brutiſhneſſe hanging head groueling downe groundward wee eyther imagin growe earth impute influence sky father vpon fortune attribute vnto men wite vppon vnhappineſſe tyme tie place finally ſtand amazed affliction themſelues ſurmizing thing rather truthe ſhould ſay god eyther could would gouerne thing onely prouidence much denie god reaſon wherof ſeeldome neuer enter ourſelues conſider owne ſtate ineſtimable goodneſſe god thinke iuſtly wee haue deſerued bee ſcourged ſinnes fatherly hee dealeth v clenſing corruption infected nature ſhewing perfectneſſe mightie power theſe frayle earthen veſſels weake mortall body none theſe thing wee take heede therfore much leſſe wee looke ſo farre afore v conſider ende god ſcourgeth v bring v backe againe repentance myght ſhewe himſelfe mercyfull father v heape vp benefit graciouſe gift vpon v greater comfort vvee conſider end worldly affliction alwayes happie ſuch feare ſhort induring trouble lyfe procureth ineſtimable weight glorie lyfe come finally wee conſider god maker gouernour hath good right ſoueraine dominion ouer v creature order diſpoze v good pleaſure ſame wrought incomprehenſible power wiſdome rightfulneſſe ſo cannot iuſtly anie fault blame found proceeding meanes wherof commeth paſſe giue v eaſe proſperitie ſo farre thankfulneſſe ſame mount vp pryde ſtep forth diſdeyning skorning thoſe hath giuen leſſe abilitie alſo procede vtter forgetting deſpiſing maieſtie though wee thing ſelues beholding thing touch v eyther good bodie name otherwiiſe miſlyking eyther wee ſtorme chafe fret againſt ſpecially ſee apparant cauſe doings wherein wee blaſpheme accuſing indirectly vnrightuouſeneſſe elſe wee fall deſpaire thinking vnpoſsible v ſcape preſent daunger wherin wee bereue cheef glorie ſhew mercie preſeruing afflicted rayſing vp ſuch vnder foote thus much v wee vtterly ſhake yoke taking nother father god heerby manifeſt wheras euery v hath name patience mouth fewe knowe right patience maner none put vre thinke ſtout bearing aduerſities without admitting anie greef hartbyting ſame otherſome take yeelding preſent affliction vpon hope outweare length tyme none theſe twayne true patience allowed god meete chriſten man appeere diligent reader preſent woork one lingering diſtreſſe without certaintie good iſſue dulling amazing ſenſes make mannes nature ſtubborne againſt god hand ſtubborne ſelfe alredye god therfore knowing frowardneſſe mankind minding eyther bring v home himſelfe leaue v vtterly vnexcuzab 〈…〉 doeth booke purpoſely aboue part holie scripture bothe defend owne maieſtie ſtand alwayes v 〈…〉 pon garde ſurprized ſo ſuttle cruell enimie bereeueth v 〈…〉 ſelftruſt driuing v ſeeke refuge ſuccour elſe god intent wee may willingly ſuffer croſſes take thing good woorth god hand ſhewed god neuer forſaketh v trouble vpholdeth maynteyneth v euen vttermoſte extremity ſecret incomprehenſible woorking alwayes ſeene world preſently perceyued ourſelues afflicting v anye hatred triumph victoriouſly ouer ſin death hell diuell damnation ſelues aſſaults world tryall fayth meanes becommeth fine preciouſe golde againe ende wicked may thinke themſelues haue ſped better god long forbearing hardening hart againſt manaces warning told longer god winketh heauyer hand bee vppon wheras theſe temporall affliction ſweete chaſtizements aſſurances god ineſtimable loue eternall reward hee calleth ſound man euen ſuch one feared god eſchewed euill alſo particular proteſtations iob himſelfe maketh xxix xxxi chapter xxv verſe xxx chapter booke defence innocencie agaynſt wrongfull without man iuſtly account himſelf noble honorable firſt poynt comly reuerend grauitie perſone wherthrough hee feared inferiours honored equalls eſteemed ſuperiours loued good honeſt men ſecond pitifulneſſe towards diſtreſſed well feeling inward compaſsion greef miſeries alſo comforting cheering ſuccoring helping third ſtoutneſſe vigilantneſſe executing iuſtice ſo miniſtred right euery man craftineſſe guyle ſixth ſtedfaſtneſſe could allured intycement eye prouoked flatterie ſtep aſide truthe commit anye vnſeemly thing ſeuenth gentle clemencie ſuffering bond ſeruants vnderlings reaſon caces thought themſelues wronged yeelding ryght euen againſt himſelf eyght ſpeedie diſpatching mennes ſutes ſo hee ſuffered pyne long lingring nynth liberalitie maynteyning ſuch deſtitute liuing tenth abſtinence bearing anye man wrong hurt hinderance notwithſtanding hee myght ſcape vncontrolled eleuenth hating couetouſneſſe welth rich could infect hart twelfth ſtayedneſſe abundance could make proud diſdeyne others ſet ſtore himſelfe haue leſſe care regard god thirteenth nobleneſſe hart ſo farre reioycing fall enimies rather pitied miſeries could anye meanes bee perſuaded reuenged ſpeake euill foureteenth hoſpitalitie giuing interteynement ſtraungers ſuch wanted releef fifteenth lowelineſſe contented heare faultes cloked ſinne doone amiſſe ſuffered ſelfe bee reproued euen vnderlinges ſixteenth iuſte vpryght dealing tennants paying truely whatſoeuer tooke oppreſsing greeuouſe rente incommes ſeruices finally verie welſpring vertue moother true nobilitie ye would ſay verie locke key good conuerſation among men hee proteſteth god alwayes eye one pure ſound vncorrupt religion feare god afrayde bondman lord trewand schoolemayſter theef gallowes conceyue ſuch inward reuerence reaſon iuſtice mercie wiſedome power prouidence ryghtuouſeneſſe thinke woorthie honour obedience yeeld ſame willingly hartely vnto ſo wee would lothe ſorie offend euen though wee myght ſure ſcape vnpuniſhed onely meanes bring v whervnto ryght knowing holie woord ſtedfaſt cleauing therevnto without ſwaruing one way without taking leaue anye thing warranted feare god cauſed iob drawe eyeſight alwayes inward looke vnto god regarding eyther owne affection luſtes ſtirred power rich authoritie inabled doo outward occaſions oportunities moued intycementes world perſuaſions men allured doo finally fame infamie gayne loſſe loue hatred anye thing elſe prouoked doo knewe ought bee doone ryght equitie reaſon conſcience mennes eye meene myndes wittes deede eye lampes lyght whole man occupyed outwardly eyther ruſhe foorth lewdneſſe become vtterly wicked like wild horſes haue caſt ryders runne looce witherſoeuer furie inforceth greater ſuch perſones harme bothe deede example elſe bee dazeled glittering gloſſe vainglorie accompanied feare puniſhment hope reward ſo finally fall ſound ſleepe ſenſleſſe hypocriſie thing obedience owne god theſe later ſort tolerable actiue ciuill life oftentymes greate good bothe neyghbours whole common weale neuer themſelues bycauſe good ſpringeth right roote hartie obedience god ne tendeth right end glorie god therfore may well bee likened ſhipwrights builded arke noe yet periſhed themſelues flud ſort good nother themſelues others except againſt will god maketh enſample rightfull iuſtice giuing due reward wickedneſſe howbeeit foraſmuchas theſe thing together others poynts reherſed epiſtle largely ſubſtātially diſcuſſed faithfull learned ſeruant god maiſter iohn caluin theſe sermon vppon booke iob vnſeemly thing vnexpert welneere inferioures regard neglect euen beſt thing according ſuperiors ſeeme make leſſe account godly well diſpoſed men haue taken peines open scripture vnderſtanding capacitie people doings writing oftentymes ſlightly negligently receyued deſerue wellyking ſuch noble men magiſtrates god hath moreouer innobled knowledge goſpell greate furtherance good accepting bothe among inferiour degree god looketh ſo glorified hand vvherfore humbly commend woork together tranſlation therof vnto good l accuſtomed fauour wherof haue ſo often trial heretofore accepting diuers woorks mine though conteyning good commendable godly matter yet like ſubſtance importance trauell vnto truſt goodneſſe bothe reſpecte newyere vnder benefit whereof bolder preſent token bound dutie thankfull mynd towards honour alſo reſpect woork ſelf aduizedly red doubtleſſe yeeld much frute expreſſed woords beare fault imperfection ſhall occurre although cōſcience beare mee witneſſe haue delt playnly faithfully reſpects ſtepped aſide willingly poynt beaten path although ſome may thinke ſtraunge hee aduentureth vpon ſo greate weightie woorks ſhould wyſe ſeeke excuſe ignorance ouerſight yet notwithſtanding foraſmuchas knowe generall infirmitie mannes nature eaſie ſlip vnwares woork firſt greate weyght euer tranſlated french • oong publiſhed craue ſpeciall fauour ſelf benefite churche god fault ſhall found may made priuie forward forwardeſt amend thus beſeeching god graunt l ſee many happie proſperouſe newyeeres vpon realme vpon churche god furthered aduaunced good counſell indeuer increace owne honour bothe world come humbly take leaue vvritten laſt december 1573 honour moſt humble alwayes commaund arthur golding ¶ al gentle reader greeting euer men needed learne vvhat patience ſurely ſtate preſent time ought leade yea dravve vvee looke vvell v vvee ſhall finde hath bin almoſt realme countrie vvherein god hath vttered great ſcourges ye demaund cauſe euident ſo euen blinde ye vvould ſay may ſee let old men aliue conſider vvicked thing vvhich haue ſeene committed commonly ſince vvere firſte able remember vnto day muſt need ſay vvas ſayd tyme generall flud fleſh hath corrupted vvayes vpon earth full extorcion outrage ſuch beare name chriſtiās ſayth sainct peter fulfill vvaye heathen liuing ſhamefulneſſe pride lecherie drunkenneſſe gluttonie quaffing abhominable idolatrie like good knovve cauſes aduerſities happen intent men may better bethink themſelues amend vvell publikely priuately ſo right neceſſarie • enſed vvith true patience vve ſink vnder burthen vvhen god ſcourges continue long vpon v euen alſo one point amendment vvhich requireth v neuertheleſſe thing cannot learned elſe vvhere god vvord although ancient philoſophers vviſe men vvorld haue ſpoken giuen certaine rule yet vvas neuer man found learning therof ſchoole could ſhevve knevve vvhat neede vvhen commeth putting vre deede euen thoſe tooke vpon ſayd teach others beſids doctrine vvas vnperfect itſelf moſt commonly vviſt vvhere vvere vvhen came point ſhould haue practized daungers thoſe beſt ſhevved vvot vvhat reſemblance patience vvhich neerly conſidered vvas cleane contrarie therfore vvithout cauſe doeth apoſtle ſainct paule ſend v vvhole ſcripture learne patience comfort according alſo another text ſayeth end ſcripture make man perfect readye good vvorks yet among book scripture booke iob commended v name purpoſe apoſtle sainct iames verie bare reading ſtorie ſhevveth ſufficiently vvith cauſe neuertheleſſe bee doubted help good expounder profitable euen skilfulleſt likevviſe neceſſarie common better knovving vnderſtanding diuerſitie matter furtherance mannes ovvne profiting doctrine conteyned vvhich hath moued certaine goodman put foorth yeere sermon faithfull ſeruant god churche maiſter iohn caluin vpon booke iob notvvithſtanding himſelfe vvhich author vvhoſe mouth vvere gathered vvithſtoode much could according hee hath done vvith sermōs furthermore although mē knovvledge haue trauelled giue eaſie vnderſtāding booke vvrytings yet notvvithſtāding beſides theſe sermon common french toung maner handling doctrine thereof ſo playne vvell framed capacitie groſſeſt ſorte yee vvould terme hovvbeit vvithout omitting needfull thing moreouer ſo applied one vvay behoof preſent time ſurely ſuche intend iudge vprightly vvithou • malice ſhall find good helpe heere vvhervvith content themſelues profe vvherof novv needfull ſhevv ſumme booke chiefe point doctrine vſe ſame diuerſe vvays beſides ſhall better find reading sermon firſt conteyneth ſufficient diſcourſe yet ſhort eaſly borne mynd hovvſoeuer cace ſtand thoſe read vvhole folke haue already left idolatrie giuen themſelues doctrine goſpell ſhall find heere vvhervvith themſelues▪ ſtill knovvledge god lord ieſus chriſt ſpecially ſtrengthen themſelues vvith right patience aduerſities ſuch haue yet knovvne liſted diſcerne true religion frame themſelues therafter leauing falſe religion vvhat occaſion ſo euer hath letted thē yet vvarned doctrine booke ſo chavved ſhall finde cheefly vvakened god extraordinarie iudgement iobs perſone vvhiche ſhall ſee layde forth declared length ſhall prepared bethinke thē ſelues better take profite great number aduerſities vvhich ſeene novvadaies vvorlde farre greater vvhervvith verie likely god threatneth men greate open deſpizing goſpell although thing happened yeere well puniſhmēts layd vpō vvicked ſort enimies chriſt chaſtizements layd vpon faithfull verie terrible yet notvvithſtanding foraſmuchas fevve amende contrarivviſe moſt men grovve ſpitefull fighting againſt ieſus chriſt ſome hauing begonne vvell vvex recheleſſe againe yea viterly turne avvay none thing bee looked vvill continue ſmite ſtill firſt ſort ſhall haue conſider iob ſound rightuouſe man feared god eſchevved euill according vvitneſſed liuing ſo long tyme comming lord ieſus chriſt great light goſpell vvas handled ſo ſtraungely god hand vvho loued ſame vvas end patience ſhould tried maruell though vve novv theſe latter dayes vnder reigne ieſus chriſt haue novv many croſſes beare peculiar fault chaſtized vvith ſtrype vpon ſtrype hand liuing god vvho notvvithſtanding loueth v ſeruing vvhom according vvoord vve turned ydolls vnto ſayth sainct paule theſſalonians ſecond ſort ſhall haue thinke bethinke yea chavv cudde god ſo ſhake therodde hand ouer thoſe already reclamed ſure bridle make vvalke right frovvard throughout haue gone vvay vvorke vvith iob reported heere vvho notvvithſtanding bene angell vvorld indeuering dutie god man vvhat likely lyght vpon themſelues generall amend vtterly forſake fooliſh ſhamefull vvicked idolatrie aud particularly manifeſt contempt god vvherof full liuing day epicure atheiſts moreouer ſome vvhordome bauderie ſome drunkenneſſe gluttonie according ſome country ſpecially giuen thervnto ſome ambitiouſe pompe ſome vaine vvorldlineſſe ſome ſnatching extortion vvel pryuate publike otherſome crueltie inſatiable deſire ſhed mannes blud ſpight lavves confuſion ciuill order among men ſhall ſay haue little vvord sainct peter vvey vvhich ought aſtoniſh thē thunderclappes euer rattled aire vvit chaſtizemēt begin houſe god thoſe vvhich true chriſtians vvhat ſhall end theſe vvhich rebell againſt god goſpell rightuouſe hardly ſcape vvhere ſhal vvicked ſinfull appeare behold thing good ſeruants god faithfull preacher goſpel brotherly pray day men haue done hertofore behold thing al little flock reformed church diſperſed heere pray behold thing euen ieſus chriſt yee vvould ſaye ovvn perſon prayeth may reconcyled god receiue grace ſuch vviſe may vaine hoped god great mercie vvil yet notvvithſtanding bring many ſort ſuch chaunge vvill make true earneſt follovvers goſpell hath done oft heretofore notvvithſtanding many thē ſo intreated ieſus chriſts ſake harden themſelues let ſuche vnderſt ſhall ſcape god hand laſt day may ſhall feele yet ſooner greate confuſion vvhoſe preheminence none others controuerſie day vvhich ſhall truthe get vpper hand enimies early late vvhatſoeuer betyde vvilling haue pitie vpon creature vvord giueth comfort patience ſuch pinched ſpecially comforteth thoſe already vnder banner graunting haue peace although haue none vvorld amen geneua firſt day iune 1563 ¶ table gathering toge ther ſuch place scripture expounded aptly applyed author theſe sermon firſt number ſignifieth foūd amōg beaſts fielde helper meete adam 55 b 6 24 man vvoman ſhalbe one fleeſh 363 b 35 3 5 ye ſhal god knowing good euill 526 16 6 eue ſeeing tree pleaſaunt good meat ſhe eat 571 22 577 46 7 adam 27 finis ¶ sermon maiſter iohn caluin vpon booke iob first sermon vpon first chapter vvas lande hus man named iob ſounde vpright fearing god vvithdravving himſelfe euill better profit ourſelues contained preſent booke firſte formoſt behoueth v vnderſtande ſumme ſtorie writtē ſheweth v god hand lieth determine life diſpoſe ſame according good pleaſure dutie ſubmit ourſelues vnto al humbleneſſe obedience good reaſon wee ſhould bee wholly liue dye ſpecially pleaſeth lay hande vpon v although perceiue cauſe hee doth yet ſhould glorifye cōtinually acknowledging iuſt vpright grudge againſt fall ſtriuing aſſuring ourſelues ſhall always vanquiſhed pleding againſt thē thing haue briefly beare mind ſtory god hath ſuch ſouerainty ouer creature may diſpoſe thē pleaſure ſheweth rigour thinke ſtrange firſt bluſhe yet notwithſtanding wee muſt holde peace grudge rather confeſſe rightuous wait till ſhew v wherefore chaſtizeth v withall haue behold patientneſſe man ſet heere eye according iames exhorteth v god ſheweth v ought beare miſeries ſhal ſend vpon v well afoo • confeſſe dutie ſo doe yet withall wee alledge owne frayltie wee beare oureſelues hande ought ſerue excuſe vvherfore good v haue ſuch example ſhewe vnto v howe haue bin men fraile neuertheleſſe haue reſiſted temptation continued ſtedfaſtly obedience vnto god although haue ſcourged euē extremitie thus haue excellent mirrour moreouer haue cōſider patience iob alſo iſſue sainct iames ſayth iob continued miſerie albeit hee angelical ſtrength himſelf yet bene happie iſſue ſee diſappointed hope found grace bycauſe humbled himſelfe god vpon ſight ſuche iſſue wee may conclude ther nothing better ſubmit ourſelues vnto god ſuffer peaceably whatſoeuer ſendeth v vntill hee deliuer v owne mere goodneſſe herewithal beſides ſtorie haue conſider doctrine compriſed booke wit concerning thoſe came vnto iob vnder pretence comfort yet tormēted much owne miſeries concerning anſweres vſed repulſe check wherwith ſeemed would haue daūted firſt reſpect affliction haue note although god ſend proceede yet notwithſtanding diuell alſo ſtirreth vp v according paule telleth v haue war againſt ſpirituall power diuel hath kindled fire hath alſo bellow ſay findeth men fit pricke v always forwarde feede euill encreaſe ſhall ſee iob beſides miſerie endured alſo tormented friendes wyfe aboue ſuch came tempt ſpiritually call ſpirituall temptation wee ſmitten afflicted body alſo dyuell cōmes put toy head god deadly enimie v reſort vnto rather aſſure ſelues henceforthe hee ſhew v mercy see whervnto al diſcours tendeth iobs friend layd afore make beleeue man forſaken god deceiued himſelf imagining god would mercifull vnto surely theſe ſpirituall battelles farre harder borne miſeries aduerſities ſuffer perſecution yet doth god let satan ninne ſo farre vpon brydle alſo bringeth ſeruants giue v ſuch aſſaults wee ſee iob hath endured marke well ſpeciall poynt withall haue marke diſputation iob mainteineth good caſe yet iob mainteining good quarell handle il ſetting forth vniuſt matter conuey well vnderſtanding key open vnto v whole booke howe iob mainteineth good caſe hee knoweth god dothe euer puniſhe menne according meaſure ſinnes hath ſecrete iudgementes whereof maketh v priuie therefore behoueth v wait till reueale vnto v cauſe doth thus whole diſcourſe perſuaded god doth always puniſh mē according meaſure ſinnes▪ therevpon aſſureth himſelfe man reiected god woulde make beleeue beholde heere good true caſe notwithſtanding ill handled iob raungeth boundes vſeth ſuch exceſsiue outrageous talke many pointes ſeemeth deſparate perſon ſpecially ſo chafeth ſeemeth would euen reſiſt god thus may vee ſee good caſe miſſehandled contrarie part they▪ vndertake euill caſe wit god doth alwayes puniſhe men according meaſure ſinnes haue goodly holie ſentences nothing whole talk would entice v receyue holy ghoſt himſelfe vttered plaine truth groundes religion treate god prouidence treat iuſtice treate mennes ſinnes thus ſee wee doctrine whiche wee muſt receyue without gaynſaying yet drifte euill namely theſe men labour thereby caſt iob deſpaire drowne altogither hereby ſee haue ſure grounde behooueth v looke wee builde vpon ſuch wiſe thing anſwerable therevnto according sainct paule ſayth himſelfe builded well much founded church vpon pure doctrine ieſus chriſt therfore hath ſuch conformitie thoſe come ſhal make foundation eyther chaffe ſtubble brittle ſtuffe haue good foundation ſtedfaſt ſubſtantiall readie layd hand likewiſe whole lyfe haue looke vnto point namely wee grounded vpon good rightfull reaſon behoueth eche one v ſtande vpon garde reele ne wauer one way ther nothing eaſier marre good rightfull matter ſo ſinfull nature wee finde experience time god grace may giue v good caſe yet may bee ſo ſtinged enimies wee holde ſelues within boundes ſimply followe whiche god hath enioyned v without adding ſom trick seing ſo eaſily caried away ought rather pray vnto god wee haue good caſe himſelfe voutſafe guide v ſingleneſſe holie ſpirit ſo may paſſe boundes hath ſet v word herewithall alſo put mynde apply god truth euill vſe ſo diſhonour like theſe men doe heere although ſpeake holily haue ſhewed already ſhall ſee fully hereafter notwithſtanding traytours god corrupt god truth abuſe falſly applying thing euil end ſelfe good rightfull whenſoeuer god giueth v knowledge woord let v learne receiue ſuch reuerence receiuing may deface good thing ſette colour vpon euyll thing oftentimes thoſe bee moſt ſharpwitted cunning ouerſhoote themſelues abuſe knowledge god hath giuen vnto deceyt naughtineſſe turning thing topſituruie ſuche wiſe doe nothing ſnarle themſelues conſidering therefore men giuen ſuch infirmitie ſtandeth v ſo much hand pray god giue v grace apply word ſuch vſe hath ordeyned wit pureneſſe ſimplicitie thus ye ſee ought conſider effecte vnderſtande booke wee muſte lay foorthe theſe matter length ſuch ſorte thing haue lightly touched may layd forth large according proceſſe hiſtorie ſayde man lande hus named iob ſounde vpright man fearing god withdrawing ſelfe euill vve knowe neyther gueſſe tyme iob liued ſauing man may perceiue great antiquitie howbeit ſome iewes haue bin opinion moyſes author boke ſet loking glaſſe people intent childrē abrahā whoſe race himſelf came might knowe god ſhewed fauour others ſame line thervpon aſhamed thēſelues walked purely fear god ſeing man mark god couenant circumciſed panim behaued himſelf ſo well foraſmuch certeine muſt leaue ſuſpence neuertheleſſe let v take doubt wit holie ghoſt hath endited booke ende iewes ſhould knowe god hath people ſerue albeit haue beene ſeparated reſt worlde although ſigne circumciſion yet notwithſtanding walked pureneſſe conuerſation knowledge whereof iewes haue occaſion ſo much diligent kepe lawe god ſith hee voutſafed ſuch fauour prerogatiue gather among ſtrange nation ought dedicate themſelues wholly vnto alſo man may perceiue booke ezechiel name iob renoumed amōg people iſraell xiiij chap ſee ſayd noe iob daniel wer amōg people ſhuld periſh ſhould ſaue mo men liues reſt people ſhould deſtroyed see howe prophete ſpeaketh theſe three men ſuche knowne renoumed among iewes haue touched alredie thereby ſee intent holy ghoſt namely iewes ſhould haue mirror pattern whereby knowe ought keepe doctrine ſaluation giuen vnto ſeing man whiche ſtraunge nation ſo kepte himſelfe ſuch puritie chiefe thing haue remember concerning name ſet downe heere ſayth land hus true ſome men place land far eaſtward neuertheleſſe fourth chapter lamētations ieremie ſame word hus put part edom vve knowe edomites deſcended eſau true alſo circūciſion howbeit foraſmuch ſtrayed away god church ſigne couenāt therfore take iob haue bin land hus edomite ſaye line eſau knowe howe prophet ſayth although eſau iacob natural brother borne bothe one burthen yet god mere goodneſſe choze iacob reiecting eſau curſing whole linage lo prophet ſpeaking magnifie god mercy towards iewes telleth choze worthyneſſe perſons cōſidering reiected iacobs eldeſt brother birthrith belonged chozen yonger inferior although man borne eſaus line yet notwithſtanding ſee ſoūdly liued ſerued god vpright cōuerſatiō equitie amōg men alſo pure religion defiled idolatry ſuperſtitiōs infidel touching name iob ſome interprete ſignify weeping wayling ſome take vtter enimie ſuch one hateth ſuch one wer white men ſhoot ther cauſe ſhould dout whether mā whoſe coūtrey ſo marked whoſe name expreſſed wer liued whether thing written come paſſe ſo ſhould thinke tale contriued mā ſhuld vnder counterfaite name ſet ſome thing vntoo v neuer done haue already alledged record ezechiell alſo sainct iames ſhewed right well iob deede ſeeing ſtory ſelfe declareth wiſe deface thing whiche holy ghoſt meant vtter ſo precyſely reſydue wee haue marke time although world falne away true ſeruing god pure religion yet notwithſtanding ſtill farre ſoundneſſe great deale day ſpecially papacie deede wee ſee abraham time melchiſedech god churche ſacrifices without defilement ſo albeit part worlde wrapped manyfolde erroures falſe wicked imagination yet notwithſtanding god reſerued ſome little ſeede himſelfe always ſome hilde ſtill vnder pure truth yea whiche waited continually whē god ſhould ſtabliſh church chooſe one people wit ofſpring abraham end might know picked reſt whole world true iob liued time howbeit church god ſo well eſtabliſhed afterward know child iſraell liued aegypt like ſhould haue come naught ſpecially ſee afterdeale come ende pharao commaunded menchildren ſhoulde bee killed wilderneſſe wher ſeemed god reiected vvhen come countrey canaan great battels againſte enimies ſpecially ſeruice god tabernacle yet ſo well apointed requiſite god therfore hauing yet ſettled apparāt ſtate church would ſhould always remayne ſome ſmall ſeedes amōg paynim intent hee might worſhipped alſo conuince thoſe turned aſide right way like paynim iob alone inough cōdemne whole countrey noe alſo condemned whole world ſcriptur ſaieth bicauſe hild himſelf always pureneſſe walked god ſuch time euery man forgotten menne gone aſtray ſuperſtitions heere noe iudge whole world cōdemne vnbeleeuers rebelles much ſayd iob hath condemned al people countrey hath ſerued god purely reſidue full idolatrie ſhamefull deedes many error came paſſe bicauſe hild ſcorne know true liuing god ſort honored great regard hath god always haue ſayd make wicked vnbeleuers alwais vnexcuſable cauſe ſhould always ſome mē ſhould folow thing ſhewed anciēt father one iob ſcripture telleth v preſēt ſtory ſheweth ful wel ſerued god purely liued vprightly among men ſaid ſound man word sound ſcripture taken playnneſſe poynt ſayning coūterfayting hypocriſie man ſheweth himſelfe ſame outwardly inwardly ſpecially whē hath ſtarting hole ſhift himſelf god layeth open heart thought affection ſo deſireth nothing conſecrate dedicate himſelfe wholly vnto god ſayde word hath alſo bene tranſlated perfect well greekes latines much worde perfecte hath afterwarde bene miſconſtrued much better v vſe word sound many ignorante perſones knowing howe ſayde perfection bee taken haue thoughte thus beholde heere man called perfect therefore foloweth poſsible v haue perfection oureſelues euen tyme walke thys preſent lyfe deface grace god whereof wee haue neede continually euen haue lyued moſte vprightly muſt haue recourſe god mercie except ſinnes forgyuen god vphold muſt need al periſh although whiche haue vſed word perfect haue ment well yet notwithſtanding muche haue ben ſome haue wreſted contrary ſenſe haue ſayd lette v keepe ſtill word sound looke vpō iob called sound ſo bicauſe hypocriſie diſsimulation doubleneſſe heart ſcripture meaneth ſette vice contrary vertue soūdneſſe ſayth hart hart meaning thereby double heart let v marke fyrſt al title attributed vnto iob ſhew pure ſimple mind bare two face one whood ſerued god halues laboured giue himſelfe wholly vnto true nowe ſo ſounde attayne marke wiſhed touching thoſe follow right way although goe forward limping yet ſo lame dragge legges wing caſe ſtandeth ſo v ſo long wrapped mortall bodie vntill ſuche time god haue quit • diſcharged v miſeries wherevnto wee ſubiect ſhall neuer perfect ſoundneſſe v haue ſaid afore yet behoueth v neuertheleſſe come ſaid playnneſſe gyue ouer counterfaytneſſe leaſing lette v note true holyneſſe beginneth within v ſomuch ſhewe fayreſt countenance world men lyfe bee ſo well guyded euery man ſhall commend v yet haue thys playnneſſe ſoundneſſe god right nought behoueth fountayne bee fyrſte pure afterwarde ſtreames runne bee pure alſo otherwiſe water may well bee cleere yet neuertheleſſe bee bitter elſe haue ſome filthie corruption therefore behoueth v begin alwayes text god ſerued ſpirite truth ſpirit regardeth truth heart ſayd fifth hieremie ought learne firſt formoſte frame heart obeying god iob hath bene reported haue ben ſound alſo ſayd vpright vprightneſſe ment lyfe led frute ſaid roote holy ghoſt planted afore iob vpright ſoūd hart life ſimple ſay walked liued amōg neybours without hurting perſon without wrōg trouble body without ſetting mind guyle naughtineſſe without ſeeking owne profit hinderāce folkes vve ſee vprightneſſe importeth added place herby admoniſhed haue agreableneſſe betweene hearte outwarde ſenſes true haue ſaide afore wee may well withold ſelues yldoing may wel haue fayre ſhewe men ſhall bee nothing ther hipocriſy couert diſsimulation god commeth roote within hearte vvhat muſt vve muſt begin foreſayd poynt haue told afore haue perfecte ſoūdneſſe behoueth eye hand feete armes leg anſwering thervnto ſo whole life may ſhew ſerue god howe vaine wee pretende meaning keepe ſame ſoundneſſe within heere ye maye ſee sainct paule alſo exhorteth galathians walke ſpirite liue ſpirite ſhoulde ſaye verily behoueth ſpirit god dwell v gouern v purpoſe haue gay life pleaſeth men great eſtimatiō vnleſſe renued grace god behoueth v walk ſay behoueth v ſhew effect work ſpirit god reigneth mind hand ſtained robberie crueltie anoyances eies caried leud vnchaſt lokes coueting men goodes pride vanitie feete ſcripture ſaith ſwift euill therby well declare hart full naughtineſſe corruption neither feete hāds eies guide thēſelues guiding thē cōmeth mind hart vvherfore let v indeuer haue ſaid agreablenes scripture ſheweth v ſaithe iob hauing ſoundneſſe plain meaning alſo liue vprightly ſay cōuerſant amōg neybors without anoying thē without ſeeking peculiar profit kept euē hand world alſo ye ſee reaſon god proueth whether ſerue faithfully hath neede ſeruice thing cā bicauſe deale well neybours ſo kepe faithfulneſſe toward al mē according nature ſelfe teacheth v ſo doyng yeld aſſurāce feare god vve ſee many beare face verie zelous chriſtiās ſo lōg diſpute hold long talke beare men hand ſtudy ſerue god honor yet ſoone haue neybours man ſhall perceiue haue hart ſeeke aduātage make cōſcience rake thēſelues beguile folk whē haue danger meanes ſoeuer doubt thoſe ſeke aduantage profit hypocrite hart corrupt earneſt chriſtiās ſoeuer ſeme outwardly god bewrayeth haue nothing dung poyſon theyr heart ſo looke ſoundneſſe muſt nedes vprightneſſe alſo ſay affection pure within wil folow whē haue deale men ſhall procure welfare euery mā ſuch wiſe ſhal giuē ſelues priuate cōmoditie ſhall haue indifferencie ieſus chriſt auoucheth rule life whole ſumme law prophet namely thing mā wold haue done ſelues thē perceiue cōmendatiō iob many men condemned aſmuch holy ghoſt declareth mā onely ſoundneſſe god alſo vprightneſſe plain deling amōg men plain dealing ſpeaketh ſhal ſerue giue ſentence damnation vpō ſuch ful maliciouſneſſe vpon ſuch paſſe ſnatche rake themſelues good mē paſſe ſpoyle men liuings ſort men condemned preſent texte foloweth feared god yea hee man whiche feared god withdrew himſelfe euill ſeeing iob prayſe keping right equitie among mē behoued alſo walk god without reſt nothing worth true haue ſaid afore cā liue neybors harme none good al vnleſſe haue eye vnto god thē folow natur albeit indued goodly vertues ſo wil ſeeme yet • uertakē ſelf loue nothing elſe vayngloriouſnes ſome ſuch reſpect thruſteth forward ſo much ſhew vertue appeered thē marred therby although haue ſayde vprightneſſe without fearing god yet notwithſtā ding ſeruing god regarding neybors ar two ſeueral thing likewiſe god hath diſtinguiſhed law ſuch time pleaſed haue thē writtē two table thē let v beare mind like heretofore vnder word vprightneſſe holye ghoſte ment ſhew manner iob liued amōg men ſo alſo ſaith iob feared god meaneth ſet religion hereby warned frame life aright muſt firſt haue eie vnto god neibors ſay muſt haue eie vnto god giue ſelues ouer vnto yeld due honor muſt haue ey neybors diſcharge ſelues dutie towards thē according cōmaunded helpe liue equitie vprightneſſe finally foraſmuch god hath knit v ech euery man ſtudy imploy whole abilitie cōmō cōmoditie al thus ye ſee caſe ſtandeth v hauing eye god mē wel ordering life loketh himſelf ſure hath nothing vanitie man wer able order life ſuch wiſe might ſeeme faultleſſe world yet notwithſtā ding god diſliked ſhal gain ouerlaboring himſelf walk ſuch wiſe al mē might magnify godward nothing elſe vncleannes needes muſt ſentence writtē luke verifyed namely thing moſt high excellēt mē abhominable god let v beare mind cā neuer order life ought except haue eye faſtned vpon god neybour vpon god wherfore ende may know created glory ſerue worſhip although haue neede v neybors haue either better worſe ſeruice yet wil haue reſonable creature ſhuld know knowing yeeld whiche belōgeth vnto furthermore wheras ſpeaketh feare god haue vnderſtande ſlauiſh feare men terme ſo tearmed reſpect honor whiche owe hee father maiſter feare god certaine deſire nothing honor wholly know muſt ſuch wyſe hath vttered himſelfe▪ wit maker mainteyner one hath ſhewed ſuche fatherly goodnes towards v dutie ought child towards wee vtterly vnthankfull alſo behoueth v acknowledge dominiō ſuperioritie ouer v ende euery v yeelding due honour may learne pleaſe reſpects thus ſee vnder fearing god comprehēded al religion wit ſeruice honour creature owe vnto god ſurely ryght excellente vertue iob feare god manner cōſidering whole world turned aſyde frō right way vvhen heare wee perceiue although wee liue among verieſt naugtypackes whole world ſhall vtterly vnexcuſable giuen ſeruing god ought well marked bycauſe many men opiniō amōg thornes god hold acquit excuſed afterward corrupt themſelues prouerbe ſaith hold hare hunt hound whyche one god pardon contrariwiſe loke vppon iob called man feared god coū trey iewry citie hieruſalem temple defyled place middes ſuch vtterly peruerted albeit hee among ſuch people yet hee ſuch ſtay himſelfe liued ſuch wiſe walked purely among neybours notwithſtanding time full crueltie outrage robberie ſuch like enormity place vvherevpon haue conſider ſhall turne ſo much greater ſhame behalfe haue care keepe ſelues pure ſeruice god neighbour ſeing giueth v ſuch occaſion haue witte god worde continually preached vnto v exhorted vnto refourmeth v haue done amiſſe ſtandeth v hād giue eare ſhewed v therefore concluſion let v marke added text namely withdrew himſelfe euill ſee cauſe iob ouercame lettes incounters might hinder ſeruing god liuing vprightly among men ſtay himſelfe knew right well taken libertie like men hee ſhoulde haue bene giuen al vice ſo ſhould haue bene enimie god iob walked ſo feare god ſuch plaine dealing ſoundneſſe without great ſtore incounters without diuels heauing ouerthrow caſt filthineſſe whole worlde bee withdrew himſelfe euill ſay withhild himſelfe vvhat muſt although church god yet ſee great abundance euils howſoeuer happeneth ſhal neuer ſuch plaineneſſe pureneſſe ſhalbe mingled ſtore skorners vnthrifts firebronds hell deadly plague infect mē therefore behoueth v ware ſeing ſo many ſtumblingblocks ſo great looceneſſe whereby trayne v foorthwith vnto vnthriftineſſe vvhat remedie let v withdraw ſelues euill ſay let v fight againſt ſuch aſſaultes example iob ſee abundance vice corruption reigne world albeit fayne intermedled yet let v defiled ſay commonly men woont namely wee muſt needes doo men rather let v take counſell iobs example withdraw ourſelues euill retyre ſuch ſort sathan may able make v yeelde temptation hee ſhal caſt v wee may ſuffer god clenze v filthineſſe infection according hath promiſed v name ieſus chriſt vntill hee haue pulled v quite ſoyle vncleanneſſe thys world match v angel make v parttakers endleſſe felicitie muſt labour continually therfore let v preſent ſelues face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying giue v ſuche feeling acknowledging owne pooreneſſe may always haue recourſe remedie giueth v pardoning al offēces ſo gouerne v holy ſpirit although satā named prince world haue ſuch ſcope amōg men part ſo peruerted ſee yet notwithſtanding may harried away rather good god holde v backe vnder obeyſance wee may knowe thing wherevnto called ſo may follow maintaine brotherlineſſe hath ordeȳned amōg v ſo linking ſelues one another may deſire nothing procure welfare neybors end may ſettled grace hath graunted v lord ieſus chriſt vntill make v receyue frute heauenly glory may pleaſe c ſecond sermon vpon firſt chapter 2 hee ſeuen ſonnes borne vnto three daughter 3 hee greate ſubſtance cattell vvitte ſeuen thouſand sheepe three thouſande camelles fiue hundred yoke ox fiue hundred ſhee aſſes greate houſeholde ſomuch ſurmounted eaſt 4 ſonnes vvent made feaſts houſes euery man day called three siſters alſo eate drinke vvith 5 vvhen made end feaſting iob ſent child ſanctified riſing vp betymes morning offered ſacrifices according number ſayde may child haue ſinned haue bliſſed lord theyr harte thus iob euery day yeſterday wee heard prayſes whyche holye ghoſte gaue vnto iob ſo muche himſelfe inſtruction end ſhould know ought rule life namely walke ſingleneſſe hearte ſo bee peece counterfaiteneſſe v therewithall workes alſo may yeelde witneſſe ſame ſingleneſſe moreouer feare god knowing whome muſt referre whole lyfe honoure thing muſt gyue ſelues vnto aſmuch wee bee continually beſet many ſtumbling blockes diuell practizeth thruſt v right way wee ſhould ſtande vpon gard withdraw ſelues euill recouer ſelues vnto god vntill ſuche time quite diſpatched defilementes world death inſeweth texte iob exceeding riche man great part poſſeſsions ſpecially recyted v ſmal thing haue seuen thouſand head ſmall cattell fiue hundred yoke ox many ſhee aſſes many camells lo great ſubſtance one man therefore ſayde ſurmounted east anon ſhal ſee wherefore reherſed vntoo v patience ſo much prayſeworthy hee beeing bereft ſo greate goodes brought extreame pouertie notwithſtanding continue quiet hee loſt little nothing see god hath ſo muche better tryed herewithall wee haue conſider vertuouſe mind iob ſeeing rich blinded pride cauſed ſet much world diſcharge himſelfe ſeruing god commonly ſee many men reaſon great rich become ſo loftie vnpoſſible tame abuſing credite oppreſſing poore folke beſides full crueltie alſo ſtately full pompe rich accompanied many inconueniences therefore vayne told v heere iob ſo rich neuertheleſſe alwayes perſiſted ſeruing god held himſelfe ſayde ſingleneſſe whereof mention made example riche men world warned dutie whych take good heede god hath put abundance intoo hand entangled according alſo pſalme exhorteth according sainct paule ſpeaketh timothie bee puffed vp pride put truſt tranſitorie thing world wherein certaintie rich day may become poore morrow whenſoeuer pleaſeth god ſeeing goodes world tickle may ſoone bereft rich men ſayth sainct paule ought take good heede reſt themſelues vpon thē make ydoll though ſure poſſeſſe enioy euer muſt ready yeeld vp ſhort according ſayd another text ſuch haue field vineyardes medowes corne ground money ware muſt haue care vſe ſuch ſort none ſo may poore heart thus ſee haue note vpon ſentence leaſt man might alledge hard behaue himſelfe ſo purely middes ſo great rich conſidering chriſt himſelf calleth thornes therefore example iob ſhall condemne ſuche keepe themſelues vndefiled hardly ſoeuer bee done certaine rich man ſhall haue ado walke feare god ſhall poore man true alſo pouertie ſelfe bringeth ſtore temptation man neceſsitie falleth thinking himſelfe ſhall become diuell thruſteth forward diſtruſt herevpon ſhall induced murmure againſt god according ſee many fal rage ſeemeth god doth wrong wot ſide turne themſelues wherevpon conclude thus sith get liuyng labor without men wrong muſt take way wood herevppon take leaue rob reaue many ſhrewde turnes harmes damage neighboures behold pray temptation whiche pouertie bringeth man make cōpariſon betweene rich certain richer ſort haue far greater aſſaults foraſmuch satan euer elbowe blindfold theyr eye ende ſhould ouerſhoote themſelues forgetting ſtate lift vp themſelues againſt god tye themſelues wholly world make mock heauenly life beare ſelues hande nothing hurt abuſe credite ſundrie wiſe haue regarde nothing loth beare yoke bee vnwilling yeelde reaſon thinke men baſe company ſo muche poſsible woulde plucke away light sun poore ſo finally beare themſelues hād deſerue good right ſhoaled ſet aſide row themſelues vve ſee corruptiōs infinite miſeries rich bring yet excuſe thē rich vvherefore ſhall iob made iudge afore god foraſmuch corupted peruerted great abūdance quātitie goodes hee alwayes ſerued god ſingleneſſe heart rich men made vnexcuſable let poorer ſort alſo looke well themſelues haue tolde already eaſyer man walke ſimply whome god hathe giuen ſo great abundaunce ſuche haue great raunge cace like man ſome little boate ſome ſmall riuer like ynough hee might bee toſſed like ynough hee might ruſhe againſt ſome ſtub againſt ſome banke riuer hee ſuche daunger hee ſhippe middes ſea waues ſtormes farre violent euen ſo ſay ſtands cace betweene poore rich ſurely ſo long thys worlde rowe vpon water wee may bee toſſed tempeſtes ruſhe agaynſte ſome thing euermore daunger thus poore little ryuer ryche middes ſea ſo hardly ſcape ſynkyng ſome whyrlepoole excuſe rych ſorte ſhal become thoſe whome god giueth meane holde themſelues ſimplicite vve ſee therefore generall leſſon ſerue men aſwel great ſmall behoueth ech man benefit himſelfe example ſet eye yet herewithall vertue iob right commendable wee heare iudgement lorde ieſu chriſte right hard rich man enter kingdome heauen rich themſelues hinder v ſeruing god haue ſayde hapneth naughtineſſe corruption becommeth v take occaſion drawen vnto god benefit beſtoweth vpon v drawen backe vvherefore ſee iob man wonderfull vertue ſeeing midſt ſuch rich eye blyndfolded conceiue pride hart ſo hee ſhould tread folkes vnder feete forget god become diſſolute vaine pompous perſon hilde race whyche begon lo vertue commendable done end wee attayne full equal yet euery one v ſhuld looke himſelfe goe forward marke ſette afore furthermore ſee alſo rich themſelues condemned ſome fantaſticall perſons ſurmiſe hold opinion riche man chriſtian let fynd pore may compared iob vertue let thē condemne rich mā ſhal haue ſought throughout poore men worlde hardly ſhall hee fynde one ſhall come thing neere thys man seeing caſe ſo lette v marke rich themſelues nature condemned ſpecially great blaſphemie againſt god man find ſuch fault rich thinketh partie poſſeſſeth vtterly mard whence come rich god therfore man condemneth hee ſetteth hymſelfe agaynſte god behoueth v marke god muſt nedes work farre maruellouſly rich man pore man haue ſayde afore haue alreadye ſhewed difficultie man hathe mayntayne himſelfe ſimplicitie vprightneſſe hee hath abundaunce goodes god neede vtter ſingular force hys holie spirite preſerue rich menne corrupting themſelues man deſpyze ſuche grace god doth hee lyfte vp hymſelfe agaynſt god hereby warned cō demne ryches ſelues lyke alſo ſee howe lord ieſus chriſte hath ſhewed v matching poore rich togither kingdome heauen hee ſpeaketh lazarus ſainct luke ſayeth angells caried lazarus albeit hee outcaſt among men poore creature whome account made ſomuch forſaken men yet neuertheleſſe behold angells carie ſoule abraham boſome thys abraham man rich cattell money houſhold thing ſauing houſes land thoſe lawfull haue bycauſe behoued tary god leyſure till gaue land canaan inherite true purchaſed burying place inheritance notwithſtanding mouables greate therfore ſee ſoule lazarus caried angel boſome abraham father faithfull wee perceiue god infinite grace goodneſſe calleth riche poore ſaluation vnto purpoſe maketh alſo whiche paule ſayth namely god wil haue al men ſaued ſpeketh king prince ordinarie miſſebehaue themſelues greatneſſe find hart ſtoup vnto god yea ſeemeth themſelues mortall men yet god picketh ſome himſelfe haue al loſt periſh thus ye ſee haue marke yet rich mē muſt flatter themſelues rather know howe ſtand wer vpon yee may ſoone ſlide among thornes ſo behoueth looke diligētly themſelues pricked lo eche one v ought touched carefulneſſe cōmend ſelues vnto god may walke according vpon ſaying iob ſeuen ſonnes three daughter note doth v wit god ſent bliſsing vpon make proſper meanes haue touched heretofore ſhal herafter better ſee cauſe al expreſſed intent holie ghoſt wit incomparable vertue iob beare paciently god taking away thing put hand wel declared alſo child behaued themſelues himſelf alſo part gouerned thē feare god done end ſhould vnderſtand god afflicteth v ſheweth effect diſpoſe hys creature pleaſure although wit ende ſee reaſon god handleth men ſo roughly yet becommeth v caſt downe eye confeſſe rightuous wait hys leyſure vntil diſcouer vnto v cauſe diſpoſeth thing ſo let v proceede reherſed v ſayd iobs child feaſted one another day day euery one turne called ſiſters beare company true nature may well ſtirre vp brother loue one yet men become ſo euill fewe conſider brotherhood importeth proofe herof wee ſhall ſee manye brother agree like cattes dogges brother yet ceaſe ſpite malice one another one would eate vve ſee ſuche according men grow kynde crueltie brother acquainted concord louingneſſe althogh ſo yet euery man ſo addicted himſelfe ther loue one ſuch wiſe god teacheth thus doth holy ghoſt ſet looking glaſſe eye make v beholde good agreemēt loue among iobs childrē ſpecially exerciſed themſelues continually therein end woulde giue occaſion euill miſtruſt one feaſtes made none end yeld record brotherlyneſſe agreement ſee ſaid preciſely wente ſeeke ſiſters intent frendſhip might vtter ſelfe poyntes behold great vertue albeit man may perceyue iob feared fault thing ordeyned good purpoſe good end yet neuertheleſſe ſee thought himſelf euē god might bee offended surely notable example doubt good agreement frendſhip among mē ſpecially among brother pleaſant thing vnto god vve heare ſaid pſalme ioyfull thyng brother agree one like deawe falleth downe giue foyzon nouriſhment grounde lyke oyle dropped downe aaron bearde ſo ſente ſhead oute ouer hys rayment lo two ſimilitudes ſhewe howe god loueth peace amitie among men aboue thinges among brother doe v vnderſtande men embrace one heartie loue one fieldes herbes receyue nouriſhement deawe heauen alſo thing yeeldeth ſweete ſauoure afore god good acceptable sacrifize vnto euen like ſent holy oyle poured vpō aaron head neuerthelater ſpoken ſuch imbrace one godly maner may well wicked men ſhall beare affection loue one towards maye peraduenture lynke themſelues togither accompliſhe appoyntmentes thys naught frendſhip muſt come god go god marke name brotherhood ſet downe ende wee ſhoulde taught lift vp eye vnto god looke vnto ofte queſtion louing one furthermore ſee beſt thinges world may eftſoones bee corrupted naughtineſſe men hereby wee ſee alſo nature euer ſince adam ſinned ſay euer ſince ouerſhot himſelfe hithertoo good hath bene turned euill notwithſtanding intent meaning good example vvhen husband loueth wyfe father loueth hys child good holy commendable thing yet neuertheleſſe mā found whole world loueth wife ſuche meaſure nothing may founde faulte loue loueth child ſo pure heartie loue ſhall always bee ſome medlie corruption ſo ſeing god hath ordeyned man ſhall loue wyfe preciſely ſayd loue wyues youre owne body ſhall ſo imputed faulte good turned intoo euill doubtleſſe commeth curſed nature lyke one grayne ſalt one droppe vineger fayleth marre great deale wine euen ſo men holding ſelues meaſure haue affection ſo well ruled maye fault bee found condemned many reſpects ſtraunge cace iob thought himſelfe hys child might haue offended god thing ſelfe good commendable condemned feaſting brother togither ſpecially ſith making good cheere one another mainteine themſelues mutuall amitie thing iob founde fault aſmuch throughly acquainted man infirmitie hee knewe harde keepe meaſure ſo vice ſhould intermedled way therefore tooke good heede himſelfe ſanctifyed child yet neuertheleſſe haue note iob well marked borne away thing experience ſheweth vnto v namely feaſtes banquet ſome diſorder wherethrough god ſo well honored ought firſt ſuche meeting alwayes ſome ſuperfluitie meates come thither company ſake eate drinke ordinarie hardly could man thinke exceſſe ſo much euen holieſt men feare god beſt ouerſeene true play glutton ſtuffing paunch cramming themſelues like ſwine much leſſe ſo drunken bee theyr wittes like beaſts ſo ſo much may done may ſomewhat paſſe meaſure ſo ſee man ouerſhootes himſelfe caſe ere aware ſee ſome inconuenience hapneth feaſts notwithſtāding made good cauſe intent well biddeth freēds thoſe come keepe company good hardly eſcaped ſhall ſome faulte wherof doer himſelfe ſhall priuie furthermore whē mā deale vaine fond talke ſhall haue hold withall vvhere man ought eate preſence god merrie angel ſhall ſtore vanity ſhall carie men ſuche wyſe many thē yea euen good men thēſelues ſhall thinke make good cheere except diſguiſe thēſelues tell howe yet many euill incōueniences wherby ſee god offended diuers wayes according men finde themſelues afterwarde let v marke well iob without cauſe miſtruſt doubt leaſt child ſinned agaynſte god ſeeing made feaſtes ſuch wiſe notwithſtanding faithfull ſort haue ſayde afore ſo feaſtes banquet beſt ruled yet ſome fault god miſliketh driue god cōpanie frō table men commonly wont doo ſhall ſpeake feaſting whereat men begin calling vpon name god nay woulde bee thoughte ſad matter therfore name god muſt buried hath man well ſuffized appetite tyme ſay grace behoueth remember good cheere haue made ſaye ſwyne man make mention god thought pleaſure haue taken feaſting turned ſorow afterward al muſt runne ryot ſuch ſorte ſhall talke ribawdrie wantōneſſe rather trecherie malice ſo ſhall none newes backbiting theyr neyghboure practiſing deuiſes agaynſt man man see banqueting breedeth nowe ſith men ſo inclined vice poſsible muſt ſome faulte notwithſtanding gyue themſelues brydle poyntes pray muſt needes gulfe hell meete togither make cōpactes wickedneſſe treaſon therfore let v marke well ſentence end ſith know men ſo much inclined vice marre thing good turne euill wee may take heede ſelues eate drinke one confeſſe oure ſelues alway ſinners offending god thereby true deede wee muſte bee ſcrupulous ſuperſtitious ſome bee eate bit breade quietneſſe conſcience man tell ought aduiſe themſelues doo therevpon conclude men neyther eate drinke withoute offending god come ſuche ſcrupulouſneſſe thinke ſinne thing doo fall concluding vvell let v ſet randon ſay ſuche theſe founde wee ought doo scripture leadeth v therefore let v wake keepe ſure watche wee taken vnwares vvhen wee ſet table drinke eate let v pray vnto god beſeeching gracious goodneſſe keepe v ſuche ſobrietie nouriſhed giftes wee may bee better diſpoſed ſerue ſo meates may ſerue ouercharge v ſuſteine v giue v ſtrength may bee better able occupie ſelues ſeruice god hee graunte v grace ſo paſſe theſe corruptible thing may alwaies labour heauenly lyfe wherevnto calleth v woorde god maynteyneth v worlde liue day ten fiftie yeares intent ſhould come ſayd heauenly glorie let v conſider howe wee ought behaue ſelues wee bee table let v feede repaſte ſuche wiſe god himſelfe dieted v althoughe worlde taking nouriſhment foode wee knowe let v looke vp vnto god ſheweth himſelfe father towardes v hath witneſſed vnto v wee child ſo much hee hath care theſe poore body haue loue extēd euen vnto notwithſtanding bee rottenneſſe therefore ſee god doth ſo nouriſh ſuſteyne v may meryer better aſſured goodneſſe fatherly loue towardes v hereby ſee paule ſayeth whither wee drinke whither wee eate wee muſte doo altogither name god many ſuppoſe ſhould bee thinking vpon god men come eating aud drinking whereas deede ſhould therefore thinke ſo muche god seeing god giueth ſuch vertue vnto breade woorde ſuſteyned haue v acknowledge preſence hath hand ſtretched ouer v rather cauſe wee ſhould thinke vpon god ſee eating drinking ſanctified yelding honor name therfore commeth ſaying grace let v acknowledge ſome fault may haue eſcaped v god ſurely forgiue v miſdoing ſo bee wee repayre vnto thus ſee cauſe ſayde precyſely iobs child made ende feaſting eche turnes iob commaunded ſanctifie themſelues afterwarde offered ſolemne ſacrifize eche one ſaying may bee child haue ſinned haue bliſſed god wee ſpeake whole matter ende vvee ſee iob none ſorte haue made nyceneſſe doo finally conclude ſet randon hee goeth remedie ſay god beare v infirmity albeit ſayeth child haue done dutie pointes yet ſure god haue pitie bothe vpon vpon therefore let v aske forgiueneſſe yet iob forbade child vſe accuſtomed feaſting wherefore thing ſelfe good haue ſayde afore iob ſayde ſee leawd matter truly made ſacrifize bene abuſe god name make cloke euil sacrifizes ordeyned mainteyne v euil man ſhould fode flatter himſelfe ſinnes ſo ſhould ſay may ſacrifize god contented iob therefore ſacrifized haue ſayde hee mayneteyned euill thing hee knew child well gyuing ſuch interteynement one another commendable thing ſo foraſmuche hee knewe ment finde faulte thing good ſought remedie faulte laye hid vnder myght pleaſe god amende hee ſhoulde ſay good reaſon ought craue pardon god hand end may ſupply infirmitie vve ſee maner iob proceedeth alſo maner wee muſte proceede furthermore let v marke iob cōmaunding child ſanctifie themſelues hath ſhewed maner bringing vp gaue childehood wit ſerue god bene ſimply ſayde iob ſanctified lorde man myght ſay well good man owne behalfe greate regard child inough diſcharging himſelfe godwarde hath laide bridle necke others contrarily ſayd commanded ſanctifie themſelues thing bene vayne vnauaylable doo bene taught long afore howe ought walke feare god although mengrowen euery houſe owne kept table himſelfe yet notwithſtanding iob ceaſſed keepe thē cōtinually vnder ſome awe behold doctrine profitable v parentes muſt ſo guyde child god may bee honored behoueth v marke doctrine better foraſmuch ſee ſo ill put vre theſe dayes haue child coulde well finde hart haue taught hardly ſhall ye finde one among hundred led zeale affection godward led euery man mindeth owne profite hee may well ſay woulde fayne haue ſonne taught good wit may come forewarde may make himſelfe braue maye gather good may come credite honour lo reſpects father haue deſire haue childrē brought vp man found ſo well aduiſed bent ſuch ſimplicitie ſay ynough mee childe ſerue god ſure god bliſſe make proſper although bee poore worldewarde ynough god father god alſo render ſuch rewarde vnto father haue deſerued imagine haue done muche child haue aduaunced god ſuffereth child put eye bee hangman torment vve ſee ſo eye yet perceiue howe god chaſtyzeth iuſtly therfore ſo much hehoueth v marke well doctrine holy ghoſt ſheweth v vnder example iob witte father mother ſhould holde child ſuch awe may cauſe ſerue god ſpecially circumſtance forgotten namely although iobs child growen full yeeres diſcretion yet neuertheleſſe father hilde alwayes vnder awe warning aske forgiueneſſe god offended purifie themſelues adayes ſoone child ten yeeres old thinke themſelues men notwithſtanding meete gyue rodde fiftene yeeres weare furniture man ſeeme thē ſelues bee maruelous ſellowes bee better ſillie offskoorings ſuffer correctiō inſtruction ſtraunge yea woulde thinke greate wrong iniurie offered contrariwiſe ſee ſayde father worthie haue child diſobedidient ſtubborne agaynſt vvhy ſo meete wil honored ſhould honorable wit requiſite ſhoulde ſhewe cauſe honored howe ſhall father purchace himſelfe authoritie towardes child bee obeyed keepe feare euen hauing ſuche grauitie ſtayedneſſe himſelfe child ought aſhamed gaynſay ſtand agaynſt thing father ſhake feare god howe bee child ſhould obey thern ſith themſelues yeelde god honour belongeth vnto lo heere cauſe child ſhew themſelues ſo loth bee corrected cannot kept awe namely father diſobedient vnto god ſo father child condemned heere father negligence taking heede bring vp child feare god child ſuffering themſelues bee gouerned father heere haue goodly example ſpoken ſuche may ſaye father hath kept awe long yong yet muſt ſtill alwayes vnder rod iobs child might haue ſayde ſo wee ſee although come haue houſeholdes owne yet ſtill vnder gouernance father text ſayde gayneſayde thing commaunded reported child hely rather obeyed ende myght parttakers ſacrifizes offered wee heare inough condemne theſe petie royſters make ſuch brauerie carie creſt ſo high know awefulneſſe wiſe meaneth offskoorings yet neuertheleſſe beare countenaunce men wee ſee thoſe age diſcretion guyde houſehold orderly hilde ſtill vnder gouernment obedience father furthermore concerning worde sacrifize ment according ordinarie cuſtome lawe whereby intent man myght partetaker ſacrifizes behoued puriſyed myght dewly diſpoſed therevnto albeit iob countrie lawe moyſes written rather likelyhood moyſes borne yet notwithſtanding hath alwayes bene cuſtome among faithfull ſhoulde ſacrifize vnto god ſome ſigne clenzing witte purging themſelues filthineſſe bene imbrewed defiled inuented man muſt thinke haue bene deuiſed tryfling toy men god ſhoulde bee ſo wherefore meaning put men remembrance worthie approche vnto vvhen wee come vnto god behoueth v acknowledge owne pooreneſſe aſhamed ſay howe dare preace maieſtie god fauour ſhall find god haue knowen age although wee haue ſayde ceremonic clenzing ſelues yet behoueth v haue meaning v wit time oft come vnto god make prayer petition vnto wee muſt acknowledge vnworthie ſauing wee knowe meane wherby receyueth v wit clēze ſelues beleeuing lord ieſu chriſt knowing onely waſſhing whereby ſpottes may made cleane vvill acceptable vnto god behoueth v attayne meanes lorde ieſus chriſt ſhrowding v vnder grace hath purchaced v death paſion full perfection accompliſhment thing haue bene giuen forth old time figure ſhadowes therefore let v caſte ſelues flat face good god acknowledgmēt offence beſeeching make v know better haue lefte vndone long wee liue corruptible worlde acknowledging ſelues bee wrapped many ſinnes may reſiſt temptation fleſhe buckie ſelues battell agaynſte thing may turne v aſide frō obeying god although faile diuerſe ſorts yet neuertheleſſe let v pray may walke ſuch ſoundneſſe afore may deſire nothing dedicate ſelues wholy vnto may pleaſe accept ſeruice wee offer vnto name lord ieſus chriſt notwithſtanding vnperfect vntill ſuch time glory ſhall ſhine fully v may pleaſe beſtowe benefite grace onely vpon v alſo vpon people nation earth c third sermon vpon firſt chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon text fifth verſe ſet downe laste sermon afore according alſo bath partly bene ſhewed alreadie began tell yeſterdaye ment ſaying iob ſanctified child commaunded euerye ſhoulde ſanctifie himſelfe vnder lawe lawe men offered ſacrifizes behoueth offerer bee clenzed hande doe wit howe wee worthie approche vnto god reaſon vnclenneſſe filthineſſe wee come vnto god ſuch wee bee ſelues wee deſerue bee ſhaken taken hand ſtinking carions therfore ſtandeth v hand make ſelues cleane may done men old time certaine ceremony according needefull ſhould haue ſuche healpes cōming lorde ieſu chriſt reaſon raweneſſe tyme nowe theſe dayes know ought haue recourſe preciouſe bloud god ſonne ſhedde waſhe v withall therefore meane receyued cleane god behoueth v repayre bloude lorde ieſus chriſt furthermore wee muſt alſo ſighe ſinnes meanes clenzed namely acknowledging euill v cauſeth ſorineſſe hatred ourſelues wee haue bene ſo vnhappie diſpleaſe god thus ſee haue figure comming lorde ieſus chriſt yet keepe ſtill truth ſubſtance vvhat bee done time oft call vpon god euery one v muſt haue eye owne pooreneſſe vnclenneſſe diſpleaſed himſelfe therewithall alſo deſire lorde ieſus chriſt waſhe v make v cleane bloud ſo may appeare pure cleane preſence god father done onely one day weeke ſome certayne tyme continually life long muſt beare mind ſainct paule ſayeth lorde ieſu chriſt ſacrifized true eaſterlambe end ſhoulde ſtill coparteners ſacrifyze ſpecially ſayeth pureneſſe ſayeth chriſtians ought ſanctifie themſelues vnto god yeere ought continewe holineſſe lyfe vvherefore bycauſe ſacrifize ieſus chriſt hath offered whereof wee made coparteners euerlaſting vertue thereof indureth euer let v euery morning euening apply indeuour ſhewed v wit ſanctifie ſelues vntill pleaſe god ſo graciouſe vnto v dwell v euer time lawe publiſhed god ſpecially cōmaunded iewes ſaying sanctifie ſelues morrow ſaieth moyſes lord ſhew glorie god openly ſhewed vnto v perſon ſonne yea ſuch wiſe may behold face face ſo goſpel preached ther hath god diſcouered himſelfe familiarly vnto v therefore becommeth v haue ſayd affection zel • haue ſpoken wit wholly fully giuen vnto forſaking filthineſſe may hinder v ſeruing honouring foloweth iob offred ſacrifyzes according number child vve haue alreadie briefly ſhewed although iob feared leaſt child offended god yet notwithſtanding hee forbade keepe companie ſtil togither bicauſe ſo good thing ſought remedie infirmity wherevnto men inclined ſubiect moreouer may demaunded came paſſe iob durſt offer ſacrifize ſeeing inſtructed lawe ſpecially aſmuch likely liued moyſes borne sacrifyzes mē offer vnto god without fayth deſerue miſlyked coulde iob offer ſacrifyze hauing aſſurance god vve muſte call agayne minde hath bene touched firſt lecture wit god haue alwaies ſome ſeede remnāt people world ſhould call vpon pure hart vntill ſuch time church ſetled among iewes▪ law publiſhed writing true flud no child corrupted meane thoſe deſcended race hauing yet freſhe remembrance god horrible vengeance ceaſed inuent many ſuperſtitions diſſannll true ſeruing god yet notwithſtanding alwayes ſome fewe remayning whiche maynteyned themſelues ſayde pureneſſe god commaundeth end god might cōtinually haue ſome church world ſome ſmall nūber people worſhip herwithal would alſo ſame ſhould turne dānation vnbeleeuers ſhould made vnexcuſable vve know men labour continually ſhroude thēſelues vnder couert ignorāce beare thēſelues hand cleared god haue gotten buckler god hath wayes bene ſhould euer bee ſome ſmal nūber people ſerue pureneſſe ſame haue euermore bene iudges thoſe turned aſide gone aſtray frō right way hath alſo bene cōcerning iob yea wee know alſo god hath ordeyned sacrifizings euen frō beginning world bene inuented man pleaſure bene trifle apiſhe toyes god woulde haue reiected furthermore know ſacrifizes abel preferred ſacrifizes cain reaſon faith abel deuiſed ſayd māner ſacrifizing god head could haue faith chiefe point god le • devs gouerne v faith neuer without obediēce muſt needes anſwerable god hath ordeyned ſee god author sacrifizes haue bene euer ſince creatiō world commaunded men ſacrifize vnto without ſhewing thē end marke wherto ſame tēded offred brute beaſtes without vnderſtanding bene valew ſerued mockery know god inſtructeth thoſe vnto ſaluation therfore doubt god cōmaūding sacrifyzes alſo ſhew true vſe thē might profite men ſaluation ende might know themſelues vtterly vnworthy come neare deſerued death ſo behoued acknowledge themſelues wholly blameworthie therewithall alſo vnderſtande yet ſome meanes whereby reconcyle themſelues vnto ſo firſt place wee note ſuche haue vſed ſacrifizes rightly according god haue graunted themſelues haue bene gilty death caſe man ſhould paſſe lawfull obligation bond ſome debt alſo cauſe wherefore sainct paul ſpeaking coloſſians ceremony lawe termeth obligation bond handwriting ſerue hold men bondage god ſhewe could ſhunne iudgement endeleſſe death one remedie god hath giuen owne free mercie good profitable leſſon men acknowledge confeſſe themſelues giltie god ſet owne eye haue deſerued ſo brute beaſte ſlayne know ſinnes ſake lo howe god minde allure men lowlineſſe herewithall alſo nouriſh hope although wretched yet notwithſtanding ſhould one ſacrifize offred wherby ſinnes ſhould waſhed away behold father old time vſed sacrifizes heerevpon heathen • olke haue done like hath bene without faith bycauſe knew god vnto whome ought haue done honour ſide knew ſeruice acceptable god therefore ſure ground ſtād vpon ſhort knew neither end purpoſe made ſacrifize reaſon whereof done auenture ſay ſo needeleſſe labour ſpecially aſmuch god hated abhorred ſacrifizes made without knowledge faith true ſolemnitie ynough auailed nothing aſmuche behoueth alwaies holde rule apoſtl giueth v namely outward ſacrifizes boote furtherforth grounded vpon obedience vnto god word true iob law written ynough doctrine came god noe giuen vnto child thoſe perſeuered ſame taught mē although hard doctrine men yet notwithſtanding hilde rule therof rule god ynough thē god gaue knowledge without vſing meane prophet afterwards vve ſee iobs sacrifizes made aduenture vpon aſſured grounded faith vvhen ſayde noe flud tooke cleane beaſts ſacrifize therby ſee inſtructiō frō heauen lay diſcerne betwene beaſte beaſte ſo ſhould ſay amōg theſe ſee ſome pure cleane reſidew bee vncleane needes muſte god haue taught euen ſo alſo iob made ſacrifize deuiſer it▪ yeelded himſelfe god wherby guyded gouerned property faith according haue ſayd alreadie herevpon haue conſider firſt frō beginning world god hath ſuch wiſe ſuffered mē go darkneſſe yet notwithſtāding hath left certayne recordes whereby might cōuicted curſedneſſe ſo much nothing elſe outwarde ceremony fully ynough condēne vnbeleeuers furthermore ſee alſo men wholly giuen euill ſo much peruert thing good holie god hath declared vnto turne altogither backward flat contrarie aſmuch ſee men ſo fleeting vnconſtant may perceyue haue neede pray vnto god keepe v awe ſuffer v ſtep aſide pureneſſe ſeruice befall v holde v backe herewithall alſo warned ſeruing god outward ſhew ſetting fayre face vpō bee done chiefeſt poynt ſerue deede knowing one ende hold ſelues thereunto hath bene greate pompe ſacrifices paynim yea euen thē haue ſerued god aright yet notwithſtāding one ſort haue bene reiected god hath abhorred ſort haue bene acceptable vnto heathē men made ſacrifizes great pompe incenſe perfume ſuche like thing iewes ſpecially law aſmuch paynim ment honor god without knowing aſmuch knew whit god maieſtie needes muſt ſacrifyze vnto idol forged ſet vp brayne god thē accepteth ſeruice done vnto one knoweth thus much firſt point ſecōd behoueth ſeruing god bee ſpirituall pagan haue ſurmyzed god woulde bee appeaſed man offered oxe calfe greate mockery would ſay god transfigured angry men coulde appeaſe meane aforeſayd therefore behoueth men ſet downe rule firſte namely ſeruing god ſpirituall wee muſt mounte farre hygher theſe viſible ſhapes muſt leade v heauenly ende holde v downe worlde without lifting vp mindes vnto heauen yee ſee howe faythfull alwayes eye vpon god made ſacrifice therby put minde vice ſinnes ende diſpleaſed themſelues ſame paynim knewe whit perceyue wee may reſt vpon outwarde ſhewe wee deale ſeruing god muſt come well heade wit muſt know god whome ſhould worſhip muſt vnderſtand wiſe becommeth v preace vnto ceremony vſe leade v ſpirituall ſeruice wherof mention made example theſe dayes papiſts haue many ceremony like vnto v well bow downe knee purpoſe pray haue ſuch thing yet ſee know wherevnto ſhape themſelues much go kneele downe puppet wodde ſtone whereby ſhew know god ſo muſt needes bee religiō thinke themſelues haue vncleane vnholie haue ſtore apiſhe toyes turne vpſide downe bycauſe regard god hath commaunded rather folow owne inuentions bearing themſelues hande haue done much haue patched greate ſorte ragges togither labour vayne aſmuch holde themſelues vnder rule god worde behold wherin differ know one god whome ought worſhip vnto whome muſt come meanes lord ieſus chriſte behoueth v ſerue according worde vvhen know wee may well ſay ſacrifizes wee offer vnto god acceptable vnto taketh good woorth obſerue alſo many men abuſe euen ſayde manner worſhipping god good holy aſmuch beaſtly maner true haue idolles true haue none fine masking knackes papacy wherwith ſeruice god infected marred yet thinke haue well quit themſelues haue done ſome ceremony whē haue put cap made curſie beholde diſcharge themſelues afore god ſo beare themſelues hand yet meane regard lowlineſſe haue ſpoken namely wee preace vnto god becommeth v acknowledge ſelues giltie reaſon ſinnes regard meane ſeeking fauour lorde ieſus chriſt regarde yeelding themſelues vnto god pureneſſe ſo may bee holy vnto himward paſſe whit geere haue good ſtore outward ceremony yea verely haue ſayde nothing nowe let v learne ſerue god ſpirit truth faith good guide therevnto haue eye faſtened vpon god worde leade v alwayes lorde ieſus chriſt heauēly patterne mirrour wherin muſt behold god father frame ſelues thereafter thus much concerning sacrifizing whereof mention made place nowe ſayde iob offred sacrifizes according number child ſhew ſpared ſubſtāce god indewed withall hee bene poore man bene neuer whit leſſe welcome vnto god though brought ſacrifize aſmuch meane abilitie wherwith ſayde imployed thereabout let v apply ſame ſelues haue told already wee haue ſacrifizing comming lorde ieſus chriſt cace concerneth praying vnto god according principall ſeruice hee demaundeth handes ſhoulde call vpon ſhould profeſſe whole welfare ſhould depend vpō ſhould giue thankes benefites ſhould inforce ourſelues holy body ſoule euen ſo end whole may conſecrated honour muſt alſo ſerue neighbour turnes thing hath giuen v aſſuring ſelues world end ſhoulde partaker one another ſuch wiſe mā ought giuen himſelfe v ought profite member wherewith god hath knit vnited v togither seeing ſo let euery man haue eye himſelfe true pray vnto god thing common men neuertheleſſe behoueth eche one v pricke forward himſelfe according knowledge hee hath vvhen man better taught others certayne ought ſo much earneſt feruent praying vnto god alſo haue greater care himſelfe thus ye ſee howe wee ought conſider abilitie meaſure afterwarde commeth offering ſelues vnto god behoueth v haue eye hee hath indewed v withall according euery v hath receyued ſo ſhall blameworthy glorifie god whenſoeuer god giueth abundance ſpirit vnto v men muſt looke well make neighbour parte taker v ſuche haue wiſedome giue coūſell vnto others ſuch haue abundance ſuccour ſuch haue neede lo heere howe wee ought frame ſelues vnto ſpoken iob namely hee offered ſacrifizes according number child reſidewe whereas ſayde iob offered ſacrifize child ſhew v ſuche haue charge others muſt watchfull fault happeneth muſte hold themſelues blameworthie god ſame well worthie marked ſee ambition reigneth worlde man haue many child glad hath ſo many reaſonable creature vnder cōmaundement haue wherwith finde great houſehold liketh well himſelfe meere ambition vayneglorye regarde charge matched true god doeth men great honour gyueth thoſe whome hath created owne image vnto thē vnderlings yet therewithall honour carieth greate bonde namely ſuch haue houſeholdes gouerne muſt alwayes watchfull offence bee committed agaynſt god houſehold head maiſter houſe muſt thinke himſelfe blameworthie muſt mourne god himſelfe partie done deede although bee conſenting vnto yet muſt thinke thus himſelfe haue diſcharged ſelfe dutie albeit watch night day although exhort well child alſo men ſeruants mayde ſeruants ſerue god yet impoſsible doe ought ſee childrē offend ſee fault men ſeruants maide ſeruantes whome take although take payne inſtructe yet many thing founde fault haue giuen ſuch example ought walked feare god becommeth muſte needes haue folowed ſteppes ſo may ſtepping aſide right way hath bene defaulte offence therefore muſt ſhew ſuch example would haue folow father maiſters haue child ſeruants vnder hand regarde thing would better ordered bee aboue others prince magiſtrates ought marke preſident behoueth watchfull ſet good gard vpon ſuch committed charge ſo fault muſt thinke themſelues blame eſpie diſorders looceneſſe muſt aſſure themſelues bicauſe thēſelues haue diſcharged dutie likewiſe miniſters god worde perceyue church behaueth ſelfe ought ſo haue trouble contrariety ſpecially god name blaſphemed behoueth ſigh beare burthen aſſuring themſelues god ſheweth vnto haue diſcharged themſelues ſhould haue done heere ye ſee sainct paule ſayeth hee brought lowe bicauſe fault church corinth behold god ſayeth ſhame sainct paule conſented whoredome robberie wantōneſſe ſuch vice corinthian laboured rebuke meanes poſsible ſayde ſhewed way riot whit although hee diſcharged himſelf vttermoſt towards men yet notwithſtanding ceaſſed feele ſtill god ment diſgrace part ſo faine bewayle offence diſorders happened church wherof direction charge sainct paule ſuch zeale dutie neuertheleſſe feele himſelf blameworthy befell miſorder church pray become v colde yce reſpect ſhall become whiche make account whither god honored one ſo may make theyr owne profite mainteyne owne ſtate let v marke well ſaid iob ſacrifized according nūber child let v likewiſe take good aduice hūble ſelues afore god onely aske forgiueneſſe miſchiefe come paſſe alſo preuent much poſsible parent holde child ſhort maiſters looke well ſo god ſerued honored houſes well ruled pureneſſe may litle church alſo ſuche haue honorable charge authoritie ſo much diligēt example magiſtrates circumſpect make lawes conuenient hold people good order cut thing againſt ſeruice honour god haue done ſo diligent ſee good order kept whē appointed ſo ſhut eye make countenance perceyuing miſorder whit faulte committed alwayes haue medicine preſeruatiue hande miniſters god word tarie tyll marred till diuell haue gotten full ſcope aſſoone perceyue breach thing folow good aray indeuour remedy ſpeede poſsible end thing go hauocke cōmonly wont foloweth iob ſayd may bee child haue ſinned haue bliſſed god ſo worde worde worde bliſſe ſometimes taken curſe ſayde naboth bliſſed god king ſay curſed ſhall ſee ſuche example againe hereafter thē declare large maner word put two contrarie ſignifications wee come let v mark reported text iob ſayde may child haue ſinned heere ſee iob wayted god ſhoulde ſende ſome meſſage threaten ſinnes child preuented matter careful without man warning ſaying maye bee child haue done amiſſe poynt ought marke well adayes abide admoniſhed told fault although fault notorious al reſpects yet poſsible finde ſome ſhift excuſe hide thēſelues ſo much man rebuke amiſſe muſt prepare himſelf ſuſtaine mortall war hand ſo ſhal deadly foe procuring welfare men cannot abide rebuked amiſſe wil thēſelues owne good blame themſelues worthie reproued ſay poſsible haue committed ſuch fault either mine ſe iob thought always himſelf poſsible child haue ſinned ſo holy ghoſte hath ſhewed v oure duetie wit perceiue ſelues faultie worthie bee condemned euery v muſte pricke ſpurre vp himſelfe make owne accuſation owne good vpon farre ſtronger reaſon ſay god ſo gracious vnto v prouoke v ſo haue others exhort v duty ſtubborne againſt god vpon ſending ſuche meſſengers vnto v ſuffer ſelues reproued certaine wee ſet ſelues againſt mortall men bende ſelues agaynſt maieſtie god would fayne plucke v backe ſaluation hee ſeeth v readie throwe ſelues headlong euerlaſting deſtruction marke ſpeciall point waye ſee iob tooke thought onely himſelfe alſo thoſe committed charge according haue ſayd adayes men cleane contrarie mā excuſe himſelf taketh couert faſt may hath man done hee ſtreyt make leazing diſcharge himſelfe maye acknowne faulte haue eyther child ſeruants ſeeke diſcharge himſelf way ſaying yea marie haue heard ſuch thing done long thus wee ſee moſt parte men ſeeke ſuch ſtartingholes bene muche iobs behoofe haue layde burden vpon others knewe child amiſſe himſelfe ſhould yeeld account let v learne ſoothe ſelues hypocriſie deuiſe howe cheriſh vice wee ought redreſſe muche v lieth behold ſhewed v way may demaūded whither iob ought haue tormented himſelfe ſo vaine ſo long faultes vnknowne ſeemeth bee ſufficient man humble himſelfe afore god ſoone perceiueth hath done amiſſe imagine may haue done amiſſe may haue committed ſuche fault ſeemeth needeth firſt let v beare mynde salomon ſayeth xxviij chapter right happie ſayeth hee man feareth maketh himſelfe feare ſo doth word import ſay iniureth himſelfe afrayde hardneth hart ſayeth ſhall runne headlong euill ſaying ſo salomō ſheweth v muſt walke heedefully looking ſtyll afore v whither may haue committed fault feare doubled doe v vnderſtand muſt feare wel come paſt feare come muſte namely wee beare minde howe wee ought walke aright al way haue forecaſt skill aske coūſell lordes mouth prophet eſay commaundeth v betake ourſelues holy ſpirit ende may giue v wiſedome keepe ourſelues ſwaruing one waye maner ſoeuer thus ye ſee howe ſhould feare time comming feare paſt ought although wee knowe faultes haue committed haue ſcaped many vice ouerthwart eye without perceiuing yet neuertheleſſe behooueth v bethinke v thereof miſlike condemne ſelues ſame thus ſee ſort behoueth v afrayd time paſt tyme come haue note vpon ſayde ſentence whē iob ſayd maye child haue ſinned notwithſtanding ment ſo care wee ought haue prouoke ourſelues call vpon god ſhould pardon offence end hee ſuffer v ſteppe aſide way wee maye continue pathe hee ſheweth v concluſion iob ſayeth may bee child haue bliſſed lorde wee muſt marke worde bliſſe taken curſe notwithſtanding ſignifie bliſſe done make matter odious intent may know fault bliſſe god ſay yelde prayſe hath deſerued oure handes ſuche deede heares ought ſtand vp vpon heade wee ſhould ſhake quake feare mention made curſing god ye ſee wherfore wo •• bliſſe god hath bene applyed contrarie vſe ment ſhort wordes ſayd iob feared leaſt child bliſſed god became bliſſed one curſed principall point wee haue conſider ought glorifie god lyfe hereby wee ſee alſo ende wee bee created wherefore liue therfore deſirous haue life allowable god wee muſt alwayes ame marke namely hee bliſſed glorified v haue ſuch burning zeale affection ſerue glorie may aſſure ſelues intollerable yea euen moſt horrible thing reſpects name ſhoulde bee blaſphemed curſed v ſay ſhould cauſe glory defaced ſpecially ſithe hath put image v ende ſhould ſhine forth v intent therefore ouerſhoote ſelues many liue blaſpheme god ſay bee accurſed bycauſe name blaſphemed let v beare mynde ſuche people monſters made againſt kynde neuertheleſſe let v pray god giue v grace know hath ſet v world whiche ende wee ſhould magnifie wayting moſt happie daye wherein ſhall gather v vp wholly himſelfe wee haue liued ſuche wiſe world haue ſought bee gouerned otherwiſe ſubmitting oure ſelues vnto reſpectes caces let v caſt downe ſelues face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying goodneſſe make v fele better haue done ſpecially ſuch ſort may com preſent ſelues vnto without deſire thing ſaue onely finde mercifull lord ieſus chriſtes ſake aſmuch know beſet ſo great infirmity finde ſelues phiſition heale v let v pray purge v vntill haue brought v perfection long continually ſo ſet v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge ourſelues confeſſe truth c fourth sermon vpon first chapter 6 came paſſe one day ſonnes god came appeare lorde satan alſo came amongſt 7 lord ſayde satan vvhence commeſt thou satan anſvvering ſayde vnto lorde vvalking hunting vpon earth 8 lord ſayde vnto satan haſt thou taken heede ſeruant iob vvho hath matche vpon earth ſounde vpright man fearing god vvithdravving himſelfe euill haue ſeene premiſſes life conuerſation iob among men ſhewed wiſe god diſpoſed ende might knowe liue heere belowe wee gouerned fortune god hath eye vpon v ful authoritie ouer v good reaſon ſhuld haue ſeing creature anon ſhal
