ſee howe pleaſed god afflict iob wherein chiefe thing principally touched god hath direction world thing done diſpoſed expreſſe scripture vſeth faſhion agreeable rudeneſſe ſo weake neuer cōprehend god maieſtie ful highneſſe therof poſsibly attain vnto therfore behoueth god come comprehended v wit ſhew himſelfe glory infinite according ſmal capacitie ſeeth v wherevnto applyeth himſelf ſhort ſhall neuer knowe god ſhall know ſuch meaſure ſhall pleaſe manifeſt himſelf vnto v wit according knoweth bee profitable ſaluatiō maner ſpeach wee ſee ſayd angel appeared god ſolemne high day borowed king world kepe eſtates aſſyſes certaine ſcripture ſheweth many place angel euermore god notwithſtanding execute commaundemēts according ſayd pitch tent round v gard v god hath appointed guide v end ſhould vnder protection alſo ſayd execute wrath vengeance vpon wicked yet angel ſpirits hindered ſerue god obey execute iudgement albeit cōtinually preſence therefore lorde ieſus chriſt ſaith angel haue keeping litle infant cōtinually ſee behold face father thereby giuen v vnderſtand although angel aſsiſt v feele vertue maintaining v yet notwithſtanding ioy ſtill whyle glory god ſeparated therefore wheras ſayd text appeared ment god ſendeth forth bee ſeparated maieſtie depriued heauenly life time voyage aſmuch rude groſſe scripture ment likē god earthly prince end homely familiar maner might know angel thing owne proper mouing god cōmaūdeth hath dominion ouer thē come yeelde account nothing hid frō ſo much angel haue proper peculiar authoritie themſelues although called power principality vertues god hath reſigned office vnto hath deſpoyled himſelf power himſelf abideth ydle heauen angel inſtruments power end ſhould ſpread ouerall vve ſee haue gather text wit god worketh ſuche wiſe meane angel gouerning worldly matter thē come accoūt afore ſuch ſort nothing eſcape furthermore whereas ſayd satan alſo came among angel wound himſelfe thither ſome haue vnderſtood crowded himſelf cōpanie make himſelfe good page contrariwiſe holy ghoſtment v vnderſtand angel heauen obey god willingly wholy inclyned giuen way yeelde account vnto alſo diuels hell enimies rebel vttermoſt power laboure ſubuert maieſtie practize confound thing ſo forced ſpite teeth bee ſubiect vnto god yeelde account doings doe thing without permiſsion leaue thus ye ſee wiſe satan appeared among angel yet way maner dealing diuers angel guyde v thing god hath commaunded haue nature apply themſelues vnto haue none inclination obey otherſide dwelleth reigneth holy ſpirit lo cauſe ſay thy done earth heauen bycauſe wee ſee ſo muche counterfayting ſo many horrible rebellion againſt god belowe wee deſire ſettle kingdome peaceably heere aloft angel wholly obedient vnto diuelles obey inforced ſay goodwill bicauſe god cōpelleth thē would hart reſiſt power oppreſſe could fayne followe pointes whether ſo euer liſteth leade thē herby ſee angel place expreſly termed childrē god diuel propre title aduerſarie ſo doth word satan ſignifie hebrew true mē oftē time called child god bicauſe hee hath printed image ſpecially faithfull aſmuch reformed likeneſſe lord ieſus chriſt liuely image god father alſo haue receyued ſpirit adoptiō warrāt vnto thē god beareth fatherly loue towards rightly therfore may called childrē god may alſo prince magiſtrates haue ſame honourable title giuē vnto thē bycauſe god hath aduaūced ſet hie eſtate intent knowen perſon vve ſee thē name god child may well applyed mē angel ſo called scripture bycauſe drawe vnto god bearnes brightneſſe therefore aſmuche god calleth principality vertues highneſſes good reaſon wee alſo ſhoulde acknowledge ſonnes god aſmuch may ſeparate vertue thē frō vertue god bicauſe ſtreames guſhe fountaine ſpring muſt alwaies repaire thither let v know thē honour taken reputed child god belōgeth angel bycauſe glorie vttereth ſheweth ſelfe therefore ſo much beholden infinite goodneſſe god hath appoynted ſeruāts meanes lord ieſus chriſt aſmuche lorde ieſus chriſte onely sonne god father yea euen naturall ſonne belonging honour vnto befalne vnto grace naturall ſonne ſame cauſe onely ſonne alſo aſmuche ſay lorde ieſus chriſt hath bene ſpared redemption ſaluation angel alſo child god meane appoynted ſerue v apoſtle ſheweth epiſtle hebrewes alſo ſhewed iacobs ladder ſayd angel came downe frō heauen earth ieſus chriſt affirmeth ſame thing accompliſhed kingdome ſhall ſee angel ſayeth come downe heauen vnto men ſeeing perceyue god hath ordeyned angel ſerue welfare ſo much wee bound mercie moreouer hath done v ſo greate honour sōne redeeme v hath taken vpō nature angel apoſtle ſayeth hath clothed himſelfe nature ſubſtance vvhen ſee sōne god come ſo neere vnto v vouchſaue parttaker man nature wee may perceyue ſo verie welſping whence proceedeth grace angel trauell watch behalfe alſo peculiar charge vocatiō procure welfare according herevnto holy ghoſt ſholeth satan ſheweth willingly ſeruāts god wiſe euen child vvhē childe obeyeth father doeth againſt doeth bicauſe inclined revnto bicauſe owne nature teacheth ſo bicauſe hath certaine louingneſſe induceth diſcharge himſelfe duetie euen ſo angel otherſide satan aduerſarie albeit appeareth god fayne render account yet yeelded owne accorde hee willing ſubiect vnto god rather rowzed himſelfe againſt inflamed ſo exceſsiue rage woulde haue ouerthrowen god power bene poſsible hild ſtill natural corruption wit alwaies enemie yet cōſtreined come homage hath ſoueraine dominion ouer creature satan alſo ſubiect vnto god therfore may ſurmyzed satan hath authoritie giuen god good reaſon ſhoulde ſubiect ſith al thing proceede frō diuels created god well angel howbeit ſuche vve muſt alwayes hold certaintie naughtineſſe diuels proceedeth thēſelues became apoſtataes ſeparate themſelues fountaine rightuouſneſſe forſooke god turned themſelues away frō lo peruerted became altogither euill likewiſe wheras ſinne mās nature god putting creation reaſon satā ſpreade naughtineſſe abrode ſuch time mā beguiled wylineſſe diſappoint benefit god thus ye ſee diuels became accurſed thē ſelues cruell full rebellion full lying full wickedneſſe came altogither turning away frō creator scripture teacheth v yet ceaſe alwayes vnder hād god therfore thing knowledge therof whē ſayde diuell prince worlde inough make v afrayde knowe bridle alofte reyneth backe hindreth would satās power limited hee would hand haue full fling v vve knowe deſireth nothing deſtruction according alſo deadly enemie ſo ſayd another place goeth like roring lyon alwayes hard pray deuour thē diuels ſubiect god could attempt liſt thē ſelues leaue without limitation ſo god withhild backe ala full wretched ſhoulde ſtate ſhould caſt vp pray without remedie ſhoulde faith bee certaintie aſſurance defence ſhoulde haue enemy ouermightie thē one neceſſarieſt article haue know diuel hild ſhort ſoeuer play mad feende agaynſte ſaluation yet nothing permitted aboue alſo scripture telleth v rightly theſe thing wit satan prince world reygneth ayre aboue v wee bee power able deuour v ſubiects vnto finally bondſlaues nature faſt tied fetter yet notwithſtanding ſubiect vnto god whither wil theſe two point diuers yet haue contrarietie right profitable v bring v good inſtruction scripture telleth v diuell hath ſuch power raigneth men vnder feete vnder tyrannie holdeth bondes ende wee ſhould know owne wretchedneſſe wee ſee pride men glorifie themſelues ſuch wiſe would ſtie vp aboue clowdes bothe wiſedome vertue thing men bee ſo hoyſed aloft god cōtrarie part auoucheth bondſlaues satan hild bōdage ſlauery vnder go chalenge great nobilitie go wayes auaunce ſelues yet ſhall diuell haue dominion ouer ſo euer lo howe god cutteth men combes maketh aſhamed hee hath ſo brought downe waketh vp agayne ende ſhoulde walke feare wee thought wee enemie woulde make warre vpon v ſo puiſſant would ſlouthfull ſhould lyue peace beholde god telleth v satā like roaring lion hath throte euer open ſwalow v vp wee haue weapon reſiſt except giue v ſo force muſte come make v bethink ſelues well ſtand vpon garde ſleepie thē diuell ſtraightwayes take v vnprouided thus ſee scripture ſayeth diuell prince world namely euen intent firſt bring v lowe afterward teach v feare wareneſſe wee may call vpon god beſeeching ſuffer v fall satan ſnares ſtrengthen v hath promiſed ſo may alwayes keepe good watch furthermore alſo ſide intent satan puiſſance bee ouer terrible vnto v make courage quayle caſt v deſpayre ſayd vnto v nothing without god cōmiſsion muſt fayne aske leaue hee hath ſpit fire flame nothing god permitteth good pleaſure true diuell ceaſe furious venture himſelfe vpon pykes ſhall boote ſith god neuer ſuffer otherwiſe ſhall thinke good vve ſee purpoſe declared vnto v diuell ſteppeth among child god wounde himſelfe though hee bene companie order angel ſhewe v vnder god obeyſance well angel howbeit farre qualitie holy ghoſt nameth aduerſarie wheras angel called childrē god ſignifie vnto v angel obey good willing ſeruants wheras satā inforced ſo nothing neceſsitie conſtraynt let v nowe come whiche scripture addeth namely god demaunded satan whence came satan anſwered going aboute earth yea euen bunt vvhen ſuche rehearſals made know alwayes infirmitie god needed enquire satan done worlde aſmuch rudeneſſe ſmall meaſure vnderſtanding comprehend theſe thing behoueth v ſayd afore ſuch declaration agreable v herein wee ſee goodneſſe god frameth himſelfe vnto v bycauſe cānot attayne vnto mount ſo high humbleth himſelf v transformeth himſelfe end ſhoulde know good conuenient v seeing god cōmeth ſo vnto v pray ought confounded ſhame ſlowe heare hereby ſee villanie thē would bereue poore ideotes doctrine ſay holie scripture ouerhard mā bite vpon true reſpect nothing elſe darkneſſe v ſcripture hard v yet withall man muſt conſider god hath promiſed enlighten little one lowly deede ſee hath proceeded purpoſe ſet vnto v ſo homely maner men god ſheweth v howe meaning onely inſtruct greate clerkes ſuche ſuttle well exerciſed ſchooles alſo apply ſelf vnto v rudeſt vnskilfulleſt ſort seing god proceedeth ſo part vnthankefulneſſe men drawe backewarde ſhrowd themſelues vnder ſhadow colour ſaying impoſsible vnderſtande meaning holie scripture ſee god hath applied himſelf vnto v way wee haue gather chiefely minde holy ghoſt ſhewe satan office nature aboute buſieth applyeth himſelfe altogither haue ſayd hunt pray without ceaſsing like roring lyon peter vſeth ſayd ſimilitude purpoſely waken v might ſtande vpon garde night day call vpon god defende v agaynſte aſſaultes enemie agaynſt practize againſt v true ſee satan ne perceyue eyeſight hee prepareth practizeth deſtruction therfore haue ſo much cauſe afrayde guile pollicies lo cauſe paule ſayeth fighting againſt fleaſhe bloud hereby meaneth deale viſible enemy wee myght well eſcape handes ſome ſhift might finde meane reſiſt behold ſaieth ſpirituall guile fight againſt v haue ſight except god giue v eye fayth eſpie howe satan agaynſt v ſpecially tēptations triumpheth way wherby eggeth v euill laboureth marre v wee muſtefully reſolue ourſelues poynte namely diuels alwaies buzy procure deſtruction go earth bee neuer away v bee euer ſeeking meanes get v ſoone finde neuer ſo ſmall breach enter v throwe v endleſſe deſtruction wee ſurpryzed miſtruſt aſſayled according euery man knoweth experience perceyue diuell neere v yet meane wee ſee ſelues woūded death vvherfore feele wicked deſire ſelues ſo caried ſome one lewde • uſt ſome another muſt marke enemie worketh ſo craftily thus finde experience diuels euer practizing againſt v ſpecially againſte thoſe god hath giuen wiſedome knowledge although diuel poſſeſſe wicked reprobate worke effectualneſſe sainct paule ſpeaketh theſſalonians yet perceyue diuell thing make ſporte vice ſo bewitched euill feele whit bee become blockiſh sainct paule ſayeth another place whē faithfull finde mindes attaynted euyll affection satan hath preuailed ſo much make entrance know satan hath preuented thē vnwares perceyued gaue thē battell alarme vve muſt tarie till haue ſuch aſſault muſt afrayd take heede ſayde god ſheweth care hee hath v ſhould taken vnwares wante knowing aduerſaries hee ſayeth diuelles go earth continually hunting theyr pray man ſhoulde tell v enemy hande certayne bandes comming vpon v euery v would ſtande vpon garde deuiſe meanes poſsible defend ſelues withſtande ſo bycauſe wee bee fleaſhly haue care preſerue tranſitorie lyfe beholde enemie satan hath ſtore wyles ſuttleties daungerous miſchieuous enemy world deſire caſt v headlong deſtructiō know ſtrength hath bene declared alreadie expreſly ſayd hād v beſiegeth v ſides hee hath thouſande wayes winde v vvhen told v yet neuer warer token thā beaſtly blockiſhneſſe haue mind heauenly lyfe cōceyue thā ſee like brute beaſts whē tolde v satan ceaſſeth go worlde continually foloweth chace neuer idle wee muſte profit ſelues doctrine bicauſe enemie welfare deſireth nothing el leade v ſame deſtruction whervnto himſelfe come cōcerning god ſayeth hast thou marked ſeruant iob bow vpright ſounde man feareth god withdraweth himſelfe euill v vnderſtand god ſpyteth satan thoſe hath giuen grace walke according herein ſee vpon cōdition god hath ſet v worlde namely ſhoulde mirror vertue hee giueth v grace gouerne ſelues holie spirite ſetteth v vpon ſcaffolde end gracious goodneſſe mercie ſhould knowen vnto v thervpon himſelfe might glorified againſt satan perſons ſure honor ineſtimable god doth vnto v whē choozeth v ſay choozeth v poore wormes earth glorified v againſt satan make triumphes v let v conſider thing towards men ala god draw thing men may ſerue glory certaine cannot nothing euill god hath chozen v ſheadeth holie ſpirite vpon v giueth v grace bee glorified perſones ſo maketh tryumphes agaynſte enemy heerby wee admoniſhed thinke ſtraunge matter pleaſe god exerciſe v ſtore incoūters tēptations rather perceyue god keepeth v occupied frute cōmeth incoūters ought content v throughly wit god glorirified power knowen ſuch wiſe satan cōfounded aſſaultes seeing iſſue cōflictes ſuch ſo happy pray ought beare paciently moreouer like god ſpyteth satan perſon iob ſo alſo haue wee wherewith ſpite enemy whē protection god well printed harte ſo wee knowe howe hee dwelleth reygneth harte holy ſpirit fenceth v bulwark fortreſſe v marke alſo sainct paule ſayeth viij romanes hee hath ſhewed faithfull inuincible ſpirit god beareth thē record lyfe ſaieth although haue receyued fully perfectly yet notwithſtanding yea though receyued ſome one ſmall drop ſame ſeede lyfe aſſure god accompliſh hath begonne seeing faithfull haue ſuch aſſurance god hath gyuen holy ſpirit ſhew vnto bee father ende thervpon maye lift vp voyces mindes vaunt themſelues againſt satan againſt death againſt thing wherefore bicauſe nothing able put frō ſayd loue god beareth thē hath ſhewed lord ieſus chriſt thus ſee muſt haue hold v ſhall laide forth large hereafter ſpecially whē come declare miſchiefes satā wrought againſte iob howe ought take thē preſent touche whiche neceſſarye preſent purpoſe let v come text mencion made iobs vprightneſſe true haue already declared al matter ſo ſuperfluous make new diſcourſe thing haue bene touched hertofore ſhall ſuffize v make ſhort rehearſall intent bring thing remembrance whiche greatly profite know marke wherefore holy ghoſt hath declared lyfe iob new againe ende ſhoulde patterne v ſhape ſelues like vnto deſire frame liues godward ſeruice muſte firſte haue ſayde ſoundneſſe hart double ſerue god outward appearance onely feete handes eye hart march afore haue pure ſingle meaning giue ſelues ouer vnto god bee wholly abhorre hypocriſie beholde poynt muſt beginne meane haue lyfe well ruled allowed god vprightneſſe muſte wiſe ſpring feare god ſay muſte ſhewe outwardly lieth hid within v ſo roote good ſhall bring forth good fruites workes may beare record proteſtation ſeruing god aſſuring ſelues thing hande vayne conſiſteth two thing namely deale vprightneſſe equitie among neighbor mark ſpeciall point alſo haue religiouſneſſe v ſerue god imputing vnto vprightneſſe tēdeth end ech one v ſhould ſhrinke aſide himſelf ſeeke owne profite ſhoulde cōmunicate togither according god hath bounde knit v togither one bodie ſo euery man haue care ſerue neighboures turne mainteine brotherly communion equitie another would haue done ſelues thus ſee god proueth wit whither liue vprightly amōg men without hurting hindering man rather whither labour doo ſeruice vnto men principall poynt referre vnto god acknowledging ſelues wholy reaſon life death offered vnto ſacrifize worſhip homage vnto thing hath giuen handes confeſſe howe ought haue ſuperioritie ouer v wee proteſt prayer requeſtes ſhewe howe whole refuge whome beholding thing lo record behoueth v yeelde ſoundneſſe hidden harte roote hidden earth aſmuche cace ſo ſtandeth wee walke becommeth v god lyking except wee vtterly withdraw ſelues euill alſo well attributed vnto iob vnder perſone wee aduertiſed wee ſhall neuer ſerue god without greate difficulty many hinderance diuell ſtyrreth vp ſo wee keepe ryght way behoueth v leape ouer trench ſteppe ouer ſtones marche among thornes thus wee ſee manifold incombrances caſt afore v turne v aſide walking god hath appoynted yea euē marre v altogither let v learne put leſſō vre iob ſerued god withdrawing himſelfe frō euill thē whē ſee whole world corrupted ſo amōg brier cā ſee nothing euill example let v reſiſt ſuche thing ſo lazie make excuſe bycauſe world wicked froward wee may well ouerfond lo iob ſet v condemne v thoſe dayes withdrewe himſelfe frō euill ought wee like theſe dayes specially ſeeing god gyueth v warning wee cannot lyue holily without greate battelles great hardineſſe hee gyueth v grace ouercome satan aſſaultes ſuche wiſe excuſe vs▪ wee iob hath done lyued tyme thing well ordered men angelles hee lyued among idolater abundance wickedneſſe reigned time greate ſtore vyce worlde day yet iob folowed bent men bowes prouerb ſayeth retired himſelfe beeing well aſſured hee ought ſerue god let v theſe dayes alledge corruptneſſe tyme turned top • iteruie rather let v conſider god meane thereof prouoketh v bee ſo muche carefuller ſhunne thing may infect v aſmuche ſee howe vyces euill ayre wee muſt flee cace one ſhoulde tell meate poyſoned woulde haue minde meddle man ſhould tell daunger place woulde come wee carefull ſeeing god himſelfe ſheweth v vice worlde badde deadly plague ſith god hath gyuen iob grace withholde himſelfe ſo euill let v doubte hee aſsiſt v day like power finally concluſion ſayde satan ment haue ſpyted god ſaying iob ſerued naught ſo muche bliſſed ſuche wiſe euen day hee proſpered affayres ſayeth satan iob may hypocrite ought knowē thou touche thine hād thou ſhalt ſee come vve ſee howe diuell laboureth ſides ouerwhelme v ſeeth getteth nothing one poynt deuiſeth practiſeth ſome newe tricke wyles infinite forgeth ſhop therfore behoueth v ſtande vpon garde certayne haue ſayde already proſperitie corrupteth men affliction worlde doo rich willingly accompanied pryde pompe contempt god crueltie craftineſſe ſuch like thing bring delightes pleaſures ſuche ſort man becommeth altogither beaſtely satan came ſo farre ſhort winning thing iobs hande meanes turned himſelfe ſide made ſure might tryed affliction way muſt conſider god knoweth right well requiſite tryall well fayth obedience needeth counſelled diuell ſayde expreſſely vnto v doo v wit god ſende pouertie vpon v afflict v doeth partely ende wee ſhoulde bethinke ſelues bee puffed vppe proſperitie thā aduerſitie partly teache v pray vnto according neceſsities oppreſſe v herewithall muſt alſo marke diuell alwayes elbow ouerthrow v ſo ſcape one ſide ſtirres vp new temptatiō agayne ſide ſhorte ſayde one word zacharie declared v large wit satā accuſer aduerſarie child god according alſo apocalips ſayde accuſer brother expreſſely ſhewed vnto zacharie viſion satan ſette himſelfe accuſe ioſua hygh prieſte heade churche figure lorde ieſus chriſte whome hee came thither accuſe god ſo conſidering wee haue ſo ſtrong partie satan laboreth meanes poſsible throw v downe notwithſtanding wee haue bene long tyme fenced hande god wee perceyue haue great nede ieſus chriſt ſhould aduocate ſhould maynteyne v power agaynſt satan wee intrapped wile pollicies thus ſee wherof wee bee warned ſentence ende ſhoulde betake ſelues god beſeeching ſtrengthen v agaynſte temptation satan ſuche wiſe wee may neuer vanquiſhed aſmuche lorde ſhall ſtabliſh v inuincible power holy ſpirite therefore let v caſte ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes beſeeching make v feele better ſo wee may bee diſpleaſed ſelues mourne maieſtie deſiring pardon according meaſure offence may requeſt alſo ſuffer v turned obedience rather wee may continue end ſo print harte ſayde ſoundneſſe whiche hee hath inioyned v wee may reſpecte couet thing ſaue onely yeelde whiche dewe wit hee may bee knowledged bee author goodneſſe welfare wee may ſeruice lyuing true brotherlyneſſe neyghboures withholding v wrong good men ende withſtand trouble temptation world vntill come kingdome heauē may pleaſe giue grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules frō miſerable bondage error darkeneſſe right way ſaluation thereof may pleaſe rayſe vp true faythfull miniſters word ſeeke owne profite vayneglorie onely aduancement holy name welfare flocke c fifth sermon vpon first chapter 9 satan ſayde lorde doth iob feare lord nothing 10 haſte thou bene bulwarke ſides haſte thou fenced houſe hee hath doeſt thou proſper affayres poſſeſsion farre inlarged 11 lay thy hande vpon touche whiche hee hath ſee curſe thee thy face 12 lord ſayde vnto satan gyue thee power ouer hee poſſeſſeth touche perſon satan went preſence lorde albeit diuell office wit peruerte goodneſſe falſely accuſe iob though hee hypocrite yet neuertheleſſe ſo doyng hee diſcouereth euill men willingly wherevnto wee bee inclyned nature beeing wilye polityke hee knoweth full well ſide aſſayle v let v marke diuell bewrayeth diſeaſe wherewith v atteynted vntill god haue healed v grace wit time proſperitie bliſſe god afflict v change minde thenceforth beginne grudge agaynſte forgetting prayſe whiche wee gyuen ſo long hee dealte v oure deſire ſo bee many hypocrite whiche cannot bee knowen diſcouered vntill god ſende aduerſitie ſo long bee eaſe reſt ſhew rebelliouſneſſe within let lie hid lo heere cauſe scripture ſo oftentymes ſheweth v god tryeth thoſe • • ting affliction caſting golde furnace onely purge alſo make knowne thoſe twoo purpoſes affliction ſerue witte god killeth vyces v hee puniſheth v wee tamed hee commaundeth v withdrawe ourſelues worlde bee gyuen pleaſures fleſhlie delyghtes yet thing wit lyke furnace golde tryed knowe whither haue droſſe ſo alſo god ſheweth wee bee afflicting v men knowe themſelues haue bene ſo proued wee haue paſſed • iue wee ſeeme ſelues feare god nothing miſlyked v yet manie vice v wee knowe god ſheweth vnto v maketh v perceyue hee ſendeth v trouble aduerſitie finde wee infirmitie nowe god make affliction faythfull one ſerue mirror wherein beholde themſelues muche likely ſhewe men whither haue fayth obedientneſſe harte whither bee hypocrite whither ſerue truthe yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne experience ſheweth v ſo wee ſee greate number god ſendeth thing theyr pleaſure doo ſpeake ſweete ſugre ſay yee woulde maruell heare howe good god ſhall bee prayſed ſpeciallie finde theyr diſhes full furniſhed ſo nothing wanting ô well lyketh confeſſe god good hee beginne handle thing roughly thing fall contentation take ſore harte god proceede plucke theyr fethers fall yet outrage murmuring yea belke blaſphemyes agaynſte albeit vtter them▪ mouthe yet theyr harte full poyſon within ſo chafe vpon bytte repine god handling otherwiſe lyke ye ſee tyme proſperitie ynow bliſſe god hypocriſie ſpeake ſuch meane deede bee worſte ſooth themſelues ſuche wyſe perceyue owne vice sithe cace ſtandeth ſo let v marke satan hath poynte eye diſeaſes wherwith men atteynted ſo ſee enemie haue lieth wayte v prieth v ſides ſpie hee may haue entrance wounde v therefore let v beare well minde wee ſhall haue prayſed god ſerued tyme proſperitie haue muſt put ſelues readineſſe ſoeuer ſhal pleaſe god ſcourge v exerciſe v manifolde miſeries inconueniences withſtanding muſt bridle ſelues haue lowlineſſe ſubmit ſelues vnto receyue chaſtyzements paciētly quietly come trial ſay wee pacient whē god ſcourgeth v al ſeruice vnto wil great matter true god well accept thoſe euē tyme proſperitie howbeit aſmuch behoueth v conſider hee maketh v paſſe thorowe ſayde boultell affliction therefore muſt wee better beareaway leſſon heere furthermore wheras ſayd men curſe god face bee combered affliction true commeth paſſe firſte puſhe yet remayne ſome reuerence god imprinted v ſo put ſome harde pinche doubte wee groyne repine agaynſte ſecretely open mouth blaſpheme god yet go agaynſt nature wee haue thus fretted chafed miſerie increace ſtyll continew long doeth impaciencie kindle fyre wee beginne fluſhe erſt bene locked vp harte thus wee ſee howe length afflicted doo curſe god face ſay howe ouerſhoote themſelues meaſure ſo regarde maieſtie god▪ humble themſelues vnto ne conſider become rebelles agaynſt ſhall attayne take holde iudgement whiche reſtreyned ruſhing ſuch outrage therefore good cauſe haue wee pray vnto god bridle tunges well harte ſuffer v time fall ſuch exceſſe curſe openly rather iſſue chaſtyzementes whiche ſendeth may ſo lucky v may turne profite welfare according intent ſhould hee ſcourgeth v lo wee haue gather ſtreyne way let v marke although satan father lying yet ſpeaketh truthe hee ſayeth god bad bene • ulwa • ke iob fenced bouſe ſides made • im proſper beholde howe hee turneth himſelfe angell light aſmuche hee god ſtoode hande ſet fayre colour matter place vſe ſuche trumperie hee vſeth towardes men deceyue thus satan groundeth himſelfe vpen true principle apply vnto euill deſire nothing el deſtroy iob hee ſayeth god bene bulwarke let v vnderſtand wee bee maynteyned worlde god muſte needes put hand lyfe many neceſsities ſubiect therefore could ſtand one minute houre wee preſerued grace god •• like wiſe thing poſſeſſe god muſt fayne fence v pray hee ſpeaketh heere euen satan whoſe comming purpoſe ouerwhelme v good perſones would ſay well walled ſo god ſerue v bulwarke according alſo ſhall ſee proceſſe texte ſoone satan hath leaue wee ſee howe hee taketh away iobs good violence go therfore requiſite iob ſhoulde fenced whyle aforehand grace god ſhoulde ſerue rāpire round leſſon greatly profite heereby wee bee warned pray vnto god may pleaſe defende v aſmuche wee worlde wee wilde woode full robber wee ſee alſo scripture attribute theſe title vnto namely buckler ſhielde wall trenche rampyre bulwarke tower fortreſſe vvherefore dothe scripture vſe ſo many woordes betoken god protection force teache v without ſhoulde periſhe hundred thouſande time day therefore muſt fayne watch continually ſafetie vve ſee haue ſayde requiſite men ſhould acknowledge lyfe bee nothing conſidering ſo frayle nothing ſubiect infinite number death ſo much thereby ſtirred vp pray god take tuicion ſhall haue lyued one day muſte acknowledge mainteyned god vnto muſt yeeld prayſe lo wee haue marke ſtreyne satan enemie truthe cōfeſſe god man defence cōpelled ſay ſo vpō racke ſeeing god hath made v taſte woorking made v feele vnthankfulneſſe ſhall confeſſe leſſe satan hath done deſireth nothing el deface rather vtterly aboliſhe god gracious goodneſſe lying ſo myght bee knowne wee ſee ſuche thinke protection god worſe diuell needes muſte turned brute beaſtes rather altogither bewitched thus much concerning woorde conſequently ſayde god gaue satan leaue listed iobs goodes condicionally bee touched perſone heere firſte bluſhe man myght maruell god ſo gyue ouer ſeruaunt iob satan pleaſure meete diuell ſhould haue ſuch credite god craueth leaue woorke v miſchiefe god ſhoulde graunte ſeemeth god fauoureth maketh ſporte v meane tennis ball let v marke whē god graūteth satan thing doth pleaſure neyther moued fauour hee beareth towards cauſe hath ordeyned owne purpoſe moued satās ſute perſwaded ſuffer iob bee ſo puniſhed hee alreadie ſo determined owne purpoſe satan vttered woorde made ſuch petition god minded puniſhe ſeruaunt minded • uſt cauſe hath diſclozed vnto v though ſame v vnknowne yet muſte wee lay hand vpon mouth ſay god rightuous vnpartiall doeth thus ye ſee firſt pointe haue marke wit god graū ted satan requeſt though hee bene moued ſute aſmuche minded owne good wil chaſtyze iob therfore graunted satan demaunde verily euen ſpyte satan haue greater triumph agaynſt putting confuſion satan made full reckening iob ſhould haue curſed god face ſay ſhould haue blaſphemed open mouth came beaten ſo roughly satan ſo hee conſidered ſelues wit fleeting water ſtrēgth nothing meane vnderſtanding god grace ſtrong inuincible ſame v true feeleth hath experience ſpite hart yet knoweth whit ſee deceyued▪ ſee wherevpon maketh reckening namely cā get leaue torment v ſhal vanquiſhed hande ſhall bee ſwalowed vp heauineſſe fall deſpayre blaſpheme god lo satan hopeth pretendeth marke well god reſiſt diſappoint hope ſende grace holy ghoſt hand ſo ſhall satan cōfounded ſees hath power compaſſe thing ment haue attempted againſt god ſeruauntes go backward cleane contrarie intent god therefore knowing iſſue iobs affliction ſhould be▪ determined owne purpoſe ſcourge ſo may ſee satan inſtigation vvhy thē doth holy scripture tell v done satan requeſt▪ two cauſes firſte beaten god roddes myght knowe satan procured yea euen caſt v deſpayre paule ſheweth v text hath bene alleaged dayes ago namely haue battaile againſt ſpirituall power agaynſt fleaſh bloud often euill befalls v let v ſure satan hath practized againſt v end may withſtād faith fenſed armed mightie power god knowing satan hath ſo great power ouer v may retyre ſelues refuge able ſtrengthen v heere ye ſee whervnto scripture eye cace ſecōd point scripture meaneth ſhew god fatherly loue towards v ſomuch ſupporteth v little babe giueth ſuch libertie ouer v enimie would fayne haue ſpecially might take pleaſure afflicting v knoweth howe ſame ſingular welfare true muſt fully reſolued vpon poynte namely though knowe wherefore god puniſheth v muſte alwayes acknowledge ſame rightfull yet therwithall behoueth v ouer haue leſſon printed hart namely god loueth v ſo tenderly deſireth nothing bring v home againe ſo muche ſpareth v holdeth v lap ſo wee ſee scripture ſpeaketh ſee satan come kindle fyre hath ſewed vnto god haue iob perſecuted let v marke scripture ſheweth v god hādleth v ſo roughly without cauſe yet ſute enemie woulde deſire nothing ſo much keepe v reſt eaſe expedient v bicauſe good v ſo exerciſed affliction yea euē satan hand well doth god permit ſo foraſmuche knoweth good profitable v mark ſay haue note proue ſo let v take contrary example laſt chapter firſt booke king likewiſe ſayd god hild aſſyſe ſuche another deſcription prophet ſeene god ſet chayre eſtate hee demaunded vvho ſhall beguyle achab satan preuēted god cace nother came aforehande ſay thou wilt gyue leaue beguile achab whatſoeuer thou wilt haue god beginneth ſaying ſhall finde lying ſpirit go deceyue achab ſee needes drowned euen bottome hell wherfore god ſpeaketh ſo euen bycauſe cace ſtood vpon executing iuſt vengeance vpon hypocrite deſpyſer ful crueltie mortall enemie goodneſſe achab man peruerted al god ſeruice vtterly wholly defiled owne idolles therwithall alſo full ſturdineſſe malice againſt prophetes woulde giue eare admonition vvhen thus hardened ſinnes ſuch ſort man could gayne nothing ſeking bring right way god aſſayed wayes ſaw man forlorne hild aſſyſes demaunded hee would deceiue achab god execute office iudge vve ſee god meaneth puniſh wicked folke execute wrath vpon thē according deſerts tarieth till moued satan preuēteth preſent text queſtion puniſhing iob ſaye god dealeth roughlie one owne child needes muſte ſame come paſſe purſute enimie lo diuerſitie whiche ſheweth v reaſon satan requeſt graunted text let v marke well scripture meaneth meanes teache v glorifie god continually wee knowing goodneſſe towardes v myght take occaſion magnifie therewithall ſhould vnderſtande howe vengeance iuſte agaynſt wicked perſons hee puniſhe hee doeth office ende hee may bee feared reuerenced honored worlde thus ye ſee wee haue beare minde way man may thinke ſtraunge god ſerued ſo satan haue tolde alreadie wee ſhall wanze away like water wee bee fully perſuaded poynte diuelles ſuche wiſe vnder god guydance doo nothing without leaue yet matter wit diuells god hangman execute iudgements puniſhments hee haue done vpon wicked alſo roddes whereby chaſtizeth child bee ſhorte behoueth diuell bee inſtrument god wrath execute doeth owne voluntarie good haue ſayde bycauſe god hath ſoueraine dominion ouer creature ſo muſt needes yeelde vnto turne themſelues whither ſoeuer hee thinketh good heere one greate diuerſitie muſte marke god hath gyuen satan leaue puniſhe iob hee ſayeth beholde thou mayſt woorke thy ſpite vpon ſubſtance touche perſone agayne hath deſtroyed goodes ſayeth thou mayſt touch perſon thou ſhalt come neere ſoule herein agayne wee ſee howe god reſerueth alwayes ſoule iob ſo satan torment good mortall lyfe honour hee power enter ſoule ſeduce make burſt impatiencie wyll better vnderſtode contrarie ſimilitude vvhen god giueth satan commiſsion execute wrath vpon vnbeleeuers onely permitteth puniſhe good ſickneſſe diſeaſes ſome maner alſo goeth giueth power leade error deceyue wee haue alreadie alleaged example achab beholde god ſayeth vvho ſhall beguyle achab satan ſayde lying ſpirit mouth prophet vve ſee ther farre larger cō miſsion matter onely achab ſhould beguiled ſome outwarde meanes ſee prophet muſt beguile vnder ſhadow truth paule meaneth ſaying men haue minde obey god truth wil frame themſelues thervnto aboue god hath bene ſo gracious manifeſt himſelfe vnto ſhew way ſaluation ſo vnhappie reiect ſo great grace god refuze behold god ſendeth falſeprophets deceyuers onely ſhall peruert good doctrine alſo ſhall beleued giue ſpeedineſſe error behoueth v wey well ſaying according alſo importeth much mēt ſpeedefulneſſe error god withdraweth brightneſſe v wherby wittes dazeled become ſo dull diſcerne brute beaſts although pitte lye wyde open v yet wee ſtumble without ſeeing whit ſo bicauſe aduiſedneſſe wiſedome v aſmuch god hath giuen satan power mocke v beguile v yea euen blinde v bewitch v ſuch wiſe wote way turne v tumble ſome new ſnare beholde ſay god worketh towarde vnbeleeuers reprobate namely giueth satan ſpeedineſſe error intrap ſhall neuer perceyue dealeth ſo towardes ſuche afflicteth although satan aſſault yet notwithſtanding alwayes preſerued haue wherewith beate back temptation god hath armed thē owne power ſo satan hath leaue god putteth barre way ſuche ſort hild ſhort euery miſchiefe ſteppeth forthe vnto nothing god good pleaſure licēceth thus ye ſee haue mark herewithall wee haue obſerue god iudgments ſuche ſort executeth bothe vpon good bad true folowe owne opinion myght wonder ſhould come paſſe god gyueth ſuche authoritie preeminence vnto satan able leade v amiſſe ſtraunge thing owne imagination seing scripture telleth v ſo behoueth v humble ſelues wayte till day come may better conceyue god ſecretes incomprehēſible v day therfore muſt learne magnifie honour god iudgements hauing reuerence admiratiō vntill may better knowen vnto v wee haue ſmall capacitie know throughly therefore muſt walke humilitie cōtenting ſelues know part vntill full knowledge diſcloſed vnto v latter daye ſoeuer cace ſtand muſt ignorāt scripture ſheweth v wit god ſerueth turne satan ſuch wiſe satan alwayes readie ſeduce men haue deſerued ſpecially refuze obey truth muſt needes caried away vnto lye cōcerning faithfull god doth leaue alſo vnto satan ſo ſeduced like iob exempted inconuenience ende alſo ſee ſaid dauid holy ſtories wherof came numbered people text reporteth diuell ſtirred vp miſchief dauid numbered ſo people god dauid thē one god child notwithſtanding ſometimes deliuered power satan bee beguiled ſee thys haue good cauſe pray vnto god come ſhrowd ſelues vnder ſhadow wing hide v ſuche thing befell vnto dauid ſhall become v herewithall let v alſo marke whē god giueth satan ſuch ſway ouer faithfull little ye may ſee ſaid satan dominion ouer vnbeleeuers vpon ſtubborneharted without cauſe sainct paule maketh thys diſtinction worketh euen ſayeth vnbeleeuers thus placeth reigne satan ſeparated god cut hys church wherefore ſe owne boundes hath power wound child god lorde permitteth humble end ſo grieuouſly tormented yet whyle reſiſt aſſaultes made vpon ſhoulde vnderſtand commeth themſelues vphild otherwiſe witte grace god power holy ſpirit god giueth satan leaue tempte faithfull one ordinarily make ſerued therewith medicine herein ſee goddes maruelous goodneſſe turneth euil good satan bring ranke poyſon venim yea know hath nothing death called prince thereof whatſoeuer satan cā bring tendeth altogither men deſtruction drowning endleſſe damnation yet notwithſtanding god findeth meane euill satan turned welfare wee ſee sainct paule phyſiked himſelfe confeſſeth ſpoken hygh reuelacions bene giuen vnto god ſayeth hath prouided ſhould exalt ſelfe much lo good prouiſion profitable sainct paule wee know pride ready throw v headlong intoo bottomleſſe pit nothing prouoketh god diſpleaſure needes muſt alway ſhewe himſelfe enemie prowde ſuch preſume vpon theyr owne ſtrength wiſe ſo euer sainct paule ſame daunger god remedied ſort ſayeth paule ſending meſſenger satan buffet see satan worketh sainct paule yea euen goddes permiſsion iſſue doubt satan ment haue ouerwhelmed paule intente haue driuen wickedneſſe end hee ſhoulde haue giuen ouer ſeruice god little little withdraw himſelfe chriſtianitie reaſon weariſome trouble miſeries whiche hee endured without ceaſsing lo satan intended god purpoſed another ende namely brydle ſeruant ſhould forget himſelfe ſo exalt himſelfe much thys cauſe buffeted vſeth ſayd ſimilitude buffetting nonce would ſay god vſed hym man armes fighteth fielde giue glorious victory buffeted hym lyke boy hys ſhame reproch thus holy apoſtle whome god endewed ſo excellent giftes holy ghoſte ſo farre made vnderling satan satan ſpitted face wrought marry villanies vve ſee god turneth euill intoo good maketh al satan ſtings ſerue v medicine whereby hee purgeth v vyces lye hid v therefore haue cauſe prayſe god reſpectes yea euen though firſt ſight iudgementes bee ouer boyſtous imagination able conceiue fleſhly vnderſtanding vvhen haue well conſidered wee ſhall euermore haue wherefore magnifie god thus muche touching ſtreyne wherein ſaide god gaue satan leaue puniſh iob howbeit ſo hee forwarned ſhould touch perſone effect wee haue marke god giueth satan libertie aſſayle v ſuch ſorte maketh many ſore aſſaultes vpon v yet neuertheleſſe hee goeth meaſure one knoweth able beare expedient v finally ſayde satan wente preſence lord satan hee liſt god ſaw ſignifie vntoo v furie satan accuſtomed manner dealing witte hee worſt could without regarding ſubiect god vſed owne rebelliouſneſſe making hauock iobs goodes howbeit yet one thing ment ſaying wit satan effectuall deede ſhew leaue gotten haue told already ſtreyt determination god whiche vnknowen men nowe declared v whereas scripture telleth v thyngs whiche apparant vnto v iob ſpoyled goodes hys child ſlayne himſelfe ſore plagued owne perſone theſe thing commonly knowen men men knew rehearſed afore witte god hild aſſyſes diſpoſed ordinance nothing happened without prouidence haue eye faithe comprehend thys haue vnderſtanding reſidue perceyue onely thing done outwardly ſee wherefore ſayde satan went preſence lord holye scripture putteth difference betweene outwarde thing done purpoſe god whiche knowen faythfull lift vp themſelues aboue owne reaſon aboue naturall wittes ſhall neuer attayne knowledge god maieſtie except wee bee caried vp aboue owne abilitie nowe scripture returneth story ſayeth satan departed preſence lord ſay viſibly perceyued apparant manner puniſhed iob thus ſee meant thereby reſidue alwayes expreſſe nature satan hee inordinate rage caſteth fyre flame though would make cleane diſpatch togyther bee ſhort hys office tempte men appeareth place ieſus chriſt tempted ſayd behold tempteth terme title tempter attributed peculiarly vnto satan ſo ende wee ſhould know ſeeketh nothing deſtroy put mankind confuſion thus ſee al diligence al going trotting vp downe leade v deſtruction purpoſe deſireth exempted obedience vnto god hee myght turne vpſide downe seeing know ought bee ſo much prouoked pray vnto god take v hande tuition receyueth v ſafetie trouble satan practize againſt v god withdraw hymſelfe v onely ſlacke hande little wee ſhall ouercome satan vve ſee taught one ſide humble ſelues walke feare warineſſe ſide call vppon god aſſuring ſelues long ſuccoured ſhall want nothing yea although fayne fight againſt great diſtreſſes yet ſhall ſure victorie hath promiſed thoſe let v fall maieſtie god praying hym make v perceiue euilles v vpon knowing euery one v may feele himſelfe full infirmity yea euen outrageous vice wee well deſerue thruſt preſence herewithall let v pray ſtrengthen v ſuch wiſe holy ſpirite may bliſſe continually proſperitie aduerſitie wee may deſire thing pleaſe poynts yeelde ourſelues wholly vnto although haue enemie ouerſtrong ouer boyſtous whome able reſiſt beare backe blowes yet notwithſtanding maintenance power good god may continue obeyſance vnto end ſay euen vntill hee haue gathered v home himſelfe make v partaker moſt happie triumph hath prepared v heauenly glory graunt benefite grace vnto v alſo c ſixth sermon vpon first chapter 13 one day sonnes daughter vvere eating drinking vvine elder brother houſe 14 meſſenger came vnto iob ſayde ox vvere laboring ſhee aſſes vvere feeding 15 behold sabeans brake vppon tooke haue ſlayne thy ſeruantes vvith edge ſvvord eſcaped alone bring thee vvord 16 vvas yet ſpeaking behold vvas another vvhich ſayd fyre god fallen heauen hath burned vpthy sheepe thy ſeruauntes eſcaped bring thee vvord 17 vvas yet ſpeaking behold another vvhich ſayd chaldee haue made three band brake vpon thy camel haue taken avvay haue alſo ſmitten thy ſeruants vvith edge ſvvord eſcaped come tell thee 18 vvas ſpeaking behold another ſaying thy sonnes thy daughter vvere eating drinking vvine elder brother houſe 19 behold hideous vvinde vvilderneſſe ruſhed againſt houſe cruſhed four corner togither fallen vpon yong folke dead eſcaped alone tell thee ſayd goddes angells incampe themſelues round faithfull preſent ſtory ſheweth v howe greatly behoofe ſo garded fenced round ſee rage satan againſt al thoſe feare god conſider well ſtate life ſhall find ſelues ſubiect hundred thouſand kind death wee cannot treade one ſtep but▪ ſhall wounded haue skill enough ſay man nothing conſidering frailtie meane conſider ſufficiently malice satan vnderpryeth v practizeth againſt v caſt v deſpayre therefore lord minded aduertiſe v neede haue garded angells whych fight againſt al aſſaults satan intēdeth againſt v like sathan aduerſarie againſt v ſo doth god appoint angel mainteine v wil haue worker welfare may better vnderſtād haue touched let v firſt marke iob puniſhed ſundrie ſorts wit good child sathan hilde ſhorte ſo could attempt thing againſte perſon againſt good ſheweth ful wel god giuen thē vp hand afterward iobs childrē alſo deare owne life ther yet one poynt iob forewent good child one manner diuell policie ſend diuers temptation ſtirred vp enemy one ſide hee himſelfe ſerued ſend downe lightening heauē tempeſts ayre ſide lo ſeruant god tormented diuers ſorts might augmēt griefe trouble yet thinke thus himſelfe onely men contrarie mee alſo god himſelfe fighteth agaynſt beholde craſtyneſſe satan true ſeeme ſtraunge v firſt puſh may ſee hath moued ſome men opinion god hath ſet v downe certaine potrayture pacience aplayne ſtorie deede done ſuche men vnderſtande god dealeth ſeruantes according meaſure ſayth hee hath diſtrybuted vnto howe vve tempted alyke god hath made v ſo ſtrong requiſite ſome weakelinges god ſupporteth chaſtize humble ende ſhould take heede themſelues call vpon god earneſtly ſome farre ſtrong ſtoute wherefore ſo bycauſe god hath powred ſpirite vppon much greater abundance haue earſt ſayde accordingly god dealeth vnto v ſtrength himſelfe ſo doth exerciſe v haue fayth tried thing ſure agaynſt profit howbeit know wherefore doth bound v giue v one droppe ſtrength hee may leaue v owne weakeneſſe cauſe v bee oppreſſed vtterly deſtroyed euery minute houre ſelues wee haue meane reſiſt ſauing ſo farre foorth god ſtrengthneth v grace yet notwithſtanding haue ſayde one faſhion one ſorte abyde weake ſtyll ſorte haue farre greater ſtrength wee ſee wherefore holye men haue beene indued excellent grace haue alſo beene much tormented life vvhich v hath beene ſo roughly dealt abraham hath ſo miſerable life neuer reſt wee ſee god commaunded forſake natiue countrie hee done ſo hee taryed lingring middes hys iourney vntill father deceaſſed way ende hee went countrye yet hee wyſt way ſhoulde take whither ſhould go god vouchſaued tell countrie hee called vnto hilde foule vpon water vvhen come thither ſome troubled him▪ otherſome ſpyted nothing vnquietneſſe vvithin men wrought muche ſpyte coulde famine perſecuted ſo faine get away wife taken warde returned new begin againe faine go another place ſeeke paſture yet god ſayde take thought giue thee lande thou ſhalt lord maiſter yea ſawe nothing place ſettle yet notwithſtanding god promyſeth make heire whole worlde afterwarde lykely ſhoulde haue iſſue none yet thing ſhould haue bin comfort olde drouping yet god ſayeth vnto thou canſt haue welfare except thou haue iſſue howe could bee alreadie ſo aged could well tarric god hath giuen iſmaell muſt baniſhed cut houſe end • iſaac according promiſe god plucked ſunne ſayd go kill yet haue heard iob father heare child ſlaine lightning elſe ſome bodie hath murdered ſurely muſte needes great griefe hard beare go kill childe owne hande thing extreme doe abraham muſt come place againe heere afterwarde god giuen hym ſonne againe though bin rayſed vp frō death hee ſhewed maner promiſe hee made vnto hitherto ſayth god haue borne thee hande thou ſhouldeſt inherite lande ſo farre art thou enioying thy ſelfe taking poſſeſsion thy life thine ofſpring muſte bee dryuen hence dwell ſtrange lande vnder exceeding cruell tirannie ſpace foure hundred yeares▪ vve ſee howe god exerciſed ſeruaunt abraham ſtraunge faſhion vnaccuſtomed among men▪ wherefore alſo ſtrengthened holy ſpirite therefore hee gaue great verie rough aſſaultes see howe god woorketh thoſe excellenter ſort ende ſhoulde bee mirrours example vnto v follow good ſooth man ſhal neuer make ſuch workemanſhip little ſhop great one hee may haue ſtuffe ſtore workemen ſo thing well furniſhed good order haue ſmall ſhop hee ſhall able doo great peece woorke euen ſo dooth god vvee ſee howe conuenient iob ſhoulde ſet foorth vnto v patterne god ſhoulde plague vttermoſt intent compare ſelues euery one v may bee aſhamed ſeeing able ſuffer affliction neuer ſo light meane ſo tender pitie ſee god ſende v aduerſitie wee neuer conſider wherein ſpareth v minde vpon preſent griefe bee comforted taking holde god goodneſſe holdeth v vp howe man ſicke hee taketh ſuche inwarde conceyte hys diſeaſe hee thinketh vpon none thing neyther conſidereth matter thus god hath giuen many meanes eaſe mee withall ſuccoured diſtreſſe men haue care mee ſerued tended one man hath wife child ſeruantes tende therefore ſee god doth puniſhe mee meaſure ſay hee hath remedy readineſſe either hath ſtore elſe ſhal releued ſome vve neuer thinke vpon theſe thing griefe doth poſſeſſe v ſuch ſort ſtill chawing bitte torment rack ſelues yea euen angry god villanous vnthankfulneſſe inconuenience troubleth v wee muſt euer thinke ſelues ala good god pitie ſhall become ſhould endure griefe alſo farre greater haue deſerued god finde meanes ynowe puniſh ſayd hath rod layd vp cofers pleaſeth bring foorth agaynſt v muſt fayne feele maner ſtrypes hande wee haue doone yet wee mynde ſuch thing certain middeſt greateſt miſeries trouble haue worlde ſhall comforted feele ſome aſſuagement oure greefes nothing behalfe inſomuch leſſon written vaine let v beare mynd perſon iob god giue v looking glaſſe wherein behold ſcourged muſt take aduerſities ſo ſore hart ſo nice ſaye haue worſe let v take good heed prouoke god wrath wiſe many vnaduiſed perſons let v bethink ſelues thus surely aduerſitie ouer burdenſom bicauſe tender ſhoulde done god reache hand vnto queſtion ſhould haue trouble alone hath ſtore farre greater farre exceſsiue god knoweth meaſure keepe puniſhing ſo pleaſe caſt ſo bottomleſſe depthes ſhall caried euen hell therfore becommeth nowe haue eye goodneſſe thanke hath pitied ſpared proofe hereof beholde iob man ſeemed bee throughly fenſed vttermoſt yet ſee howe god hath afflicted onely one kinde diuers faſhions weigh ſelfe balance good reaſon ſhould pacient ſhuld humble ſelfe vnder mightie hande god ſhould applie ſelfe hys good deſyring gouerne mee diſpoſe mee creature hande deale thus ſhall perceiue god euer preſent ſuccour ſuche truſt reſt themſelues vppon albeeit ſee wonderfull ſtrength iob yet verily fraile man proofe howe could hee haue bin ſo ſtrengthned god lent hande ſtrength god vttered iob abated daye hath god altred eyther purpoſe nature wee ſee god hath ſtrengthned iob wee come promiſes belong one man alone men lo god ſheweth bee diſmayde feebleneſſe owne fleſhe hee hathe remedie flee refuge beaten hath wherwith ſtrengthen v yea though wee otherwiſe altogither forſaken seeing god offereth v remedie ſuche wiſe whereby relieue feebleneſſe let v doubt hath vphild ſeruant iob ſo wil worke v alſo day meaning nothing elſe ſeale vp promiſes common al men giue v aſſurance experience perſon one man ende wee ſhould doubt good woorde therefore let v alledge excuſe lo man vvas iob man abraham man dauid ſo whereof came reſiſted temptation yes ayded god day ſame hee chaunged ſince tyme minde ayde three foure vvhen ſayd fortreſſe bulwarke ſtick needes ment iob abraham dauid ment whole church vnleſſe wee charge god vntruth wee muſt boldely conclude like aſsiſted iob ſo alſo aſsiſt v wee bee deſtitute grace god holy ſpirite proceedeth owne naughtineſſe cauſe regarde good turne readie v giueth v promiſes although preuent v ſeeking nothing vtter power mainteyning v yet notwithſtanding ſhut gate agaynſt ſo well perceyue intent ſtory written v wit haue ſayd already might knowe howe god afflicteth thoſe withall vnderſtand hee forgetteth ſuccour neede according greatneſſe neceſsitie remedie alwayes redy due ſeaſon furthermore wee haue godly recorde affliction alwayes ſignes god hareth v haue beliefe impoſsible ſhoulde pacient aduerſitie naught saint paule ſayth ought haue comfort pacience man comfort himſelfe god though hee ſhewe neuer ſo great inuincible courage yet ſame called pacience pacient ought pacience lumbard ſay prouerbe ſay pacience perforce againſt oure mule chawing vpon hys bit true ſuche ſort woulde faine make themſelues conſtant woulde wiſe bowe ſay ſee wicked fortune thoughe wee muſt conſtant ye ſee pacience vnbeleeuers although bee renowmed worlde courageous ſtout fellowes yet ceaſſe lift vp themſelues agaynſt god finde fault bee ſhort euery wyll needes cleare himſelfe know ſay happened bee fortune agaynſt god idle hath minde thing rather elſe man ſtate ſuche ſo meane ſuche manner men ceaſſe haue heart full venim god haue v pacient another manner wit hee haue v readye endure thinges aſſuring oure ſelues good euill proceede hande hee wyll haue v abyde chaſtizemente deſyring nothing gouerned hym renouncyng oure owne affection thoughe ſeeme troubleſome v hee wyll haue v fyghte agaynſte oure owne wicked luſtes reſyſte ſuche wyſe hee alone maye continue oure maiſter poſsible ſhould haue pacientneſſe ſo franke free v wee take occaſion comfort oure ſelues god howe wyll bee behoueth v bee well aſſured god ſcourgeth v hee purpoſeth oure deſtruction rather procureth oure welfare hym imagineth deemeth god bee bente agaynſte hym hee fall intoo ſome griefe anguiſhe mynde yea euen ſome frenzie play ſauage beaſt lift vp ſelfe agaynſt god wee loue god wee perſuade ſelues ſeeketh nothing vndoo v deſtroy v neceſſarie v fully reſolued god puniſheth v tokē hateth v holdeth v enemy rather meane procureth ſaluation ſee sainct paule ſayth victorie conſiſteth taking holde loue god ieſus chriſt ſo throughly perſuaded god hath adopted v child haue principle ſhall diſmayd affliction vvhy ſo ſith god loueth v ſhall neuer bee confounded ſo little ſhall affliction hinder welfare ſhal turne furtherance god worke ſuch wiſe ſaluation ſhall aduanced meanes therof ſeeing iob beloued god one excellenteſt men euer worlde hath bin ſo grieuouſly afflicted let v aſſure ſelues god ſuffer v abyde ouer hard painfull aduerſities yet ceaſſeth hee keepe v ſtill vnder protection loue v loue prouide v thing good profitable wee muſt come ſet downe wit god puniſhed iob good alſo child marked well ſometimes ſheweth himſelf ſtout ſome one kind temptation wil quayled ſome example may ſome man ſuch wyſe deſpizeth goodes worlde hee haue bin verie riche afterward ſore impoueriſhed ye ſhall ſee ſhrink continue ſtil good quiet ſay well haue bin riche god chaſtize bereft al good ſubſtance god prayſed man would thinke man ſo conſtant ſhoulde ſeeme hee hath feeling aduerſitie beholde great vertue yea hee bee aſſayled otherſide ſo happeneth ſome newe temptation yee ſhall ſee ſo encombred hee hath meanes comfort himſelfe ynough v pacient agaynſt ſome one kynde aduerſitie muſt withſtand trouble wee ſee alſo lorde exerciſeth v diuers maners thing bee marked aduiſedly god hath ſent v ſome aduerſitie wee ſuppoſe ſelues bee eſcaped wee thinke ſtraunge ſee miſchiefe come backe againe necke ſay verie harde imagination god hath good reaſon quicken v vp ſo diuers temptation ende oure pacience maye ſhewe ſelfe haue ſayde heretofore nowe man goodes bee deare much precious muſt child needes bee ſee alſo lordes ſhould laſt tydings though iob beene ſet vppon racke vvhen man layde vpon racke tormentes continually increſed vntil come vttermoſt satan vſed like policie wyth iob hee cauſed woorde brought beholde thine ox thy shee aſſes takeen awaye sabeans robber come haue ſlaine thy ſeruants hee fyrſt put corde vvell wee ſee man layde vppon racke vvhen one came tolde beholde fire falne downe heauen hathe conſumed thy cattell man ſhuld haue hanged great weight feete encreaſe paine put griefe ſee extremitie came ende one brought word death child let v learne wee haue ſcaped ſome one aduerſitie thought ouer heauie ouerhard ſuffer god able ſend v another ſhall farre exceede wente afore sathan preaceth vppon v one ſyde god gyueth leaue ſo doo end aforeſayde ſhould paſſe ſuch tryall intent god might glorifyed v might haue ſo much greater cauſe yeeld thankes ſhal haue deliuered v aſſaultes ſuche enemie ſo mightie satan sometymes alſo doth hardneſſe ſake vvhen ſeeth dull vpon ſpurre ouerſlowe reſtie hee muſt needes pricke v ſo much roughly according commonly ſay rough horſe muſt haue rough ryder ſo haue wee nothing example iob marke haue touched alreadie alſo whiche haue ſpoken afore namely iobs temptation diuers reſpect robber caryed away goodes cattell lightning heauen burnt vp greate part greate tempeſt wynde ouerthrowen houſe hys child ſlayne vnder although enemy come caryed away cattel end broken houſe vpon child bin ſo hard ſtrange matter ſayd lightning fel heauen mightie boyſtous wind killed childrē cace iob prouoked ſay thing men agaynſt mee god hath made himſelfe mine enemie whence commeth lightning ayre whence come theſe hideous windes ſayd windes god meſſengers execute commaundements though heraulds ſayd fire heauen ſigne preſence iob therfore might haue concluded thus ſee god warreth againſt one ſide men neyther heauen earth agaynſt mee ala whither may goe herevpon hee might haue bin altogither plunged diſpayre vvee ſee temptation ſo diuers much troubled experience alſo ſheweth ſo euery man may feele ſelfe tormented one ſort yea though ſame bee euen vttermoſte yet doo wee ſtill conceyue ſome hope one man perſecuteth v one ſyde ryſeth vp agaynſt v another ſyde nūber enemy encreaſeth ſo layd ſides ſeemeth god againſt v lō ger holde quite quayle ſay like poore ſoules paſt hope nowe ſee befell vnto iob let v marke well may take profit aſſuring ſelues god wyll alſo throughly trye ſay conſtancie diuers temptation vvhen men trouble v doo v harme ſeemeth v god doth v wrong hee auenge v incontinently ſo woulde haue euen heauen bend ſelfe agaynſt enimies reuenge iniurie haue done v conſider whit howe god tryeth v wiſe hee knoweth profitable expedient v better ſelues waye manne might demaunde heere howe happened fyre came downe heauen burne vp iobs cattell diuell hath lightning tempeſts power wee graunt ſuch ſoueraintie haue dominion ayre rayſe whirlewynds tempeſts pleaſure anſwere herevnto eaſie howbeit matter ſhall handled fully next ſermon neuerthelater let v mark although windes god heraulds execute lightning haue like nature yet diuell woorketh god vſeth ſeruice hath bin declared heretofore let v think ſtrange god ſhould giue diuell ſuch libertie able rayſe vp lightning whirlewindes tempeſtes hee able doo often much hee himſelfe liſteth god ſerueth owne turne pleaſeth himſelfe thus yee ſee queſtion aſſoyled ſo yee neede maruell diuell hath rayſed vp ſuche tempeſt rage foule weather beate downe houſe hee hath ſtyrred vp lightning heauen witte ſo farre foorth god permitted ſpecially ſeeing god directed exerciſe fayth pacience ſeruaunt heerewithall ſyde wee haue alſo marke iobs pacience ſo muche vertuous commendable hee fell ſuche heighte hee ſeemed bee ſo well fenſed yet notwithſtanding ceaſſed bliſſe god euen hee vtterly forlorne ſaye woorthie ſingular commendation wee knowe ſuche proſperitie forgette themſelues ſaye onely worldling ſuche thinke vpon god alſo faythfull whiche haue walked feare god theyr life long yea euen keepe ſtill ſame mynde ouerſeene haue thing ſo forget themſelues knowe themſelues lette v marke happened ezechias although hee wholly gyuen ſerue god doo owne duetie yet notwithſtanding hee ſawe himſelfe aduaunced aboue ordinarie hee ſent prophete eſaye medled ſeeking councell god hande thing owne fanſie magnifyed himſelfe ſoo muche hee prouoked god diſpleaſure turning hande ſhewing ryches vaingloriouſly ſo muche hande god fayne fall verye roughlye vpon bycauſe follye ouerweening wherewith hee caryed awaye hee dauid meeneth ſayeth ſayde abundance proſperitie ſhall neuer bee remoued dauid knewe well howe hee bin aduaunced god hee neuer darkened grace rather minde mighte bee remembraunce worldes ende god drawne vp dung cattell ſettled ſtate kingdome hee magnifyed ſhuld ſpoken death vaunted himſelf nobilitie chalenged nothing himſelfe yet god ſtabliſhed kingdom ſo ſaw himſelfe reſt hee began aduaunce himſelfe ſayde hee brought thing ſuch point hee ſhoulde neuer bee remoued dauid ſheweth bee bee eaſe namely bee ſotted ſayde folly ſeemeth vnto v god neuer change eſtate pleaſures iolities lo haue marke namely wonderfull ſtrēgth mind iob conſidering reſiſteth ſaid temptation ſo ſodein ſo great one temptatiō many came vpon altogither one blow yet ſee hee outſtoode little afore bin ſuch proſperitie might ſeeme men fauoured hym man dydde magnifye hym bee ſhort satan himſelfe ſayeth ſhoulde ſeeme god hilde lappe hee thy hande ſayeth satan thou preſerueſt ſuche wiſe ſhould ſeeme thou makeſt cockney herewithall wee ſeehowe hee handled turning hande thing might haue bin verye hard matter hym much warned ceaſſe looke well ſelues god ſendeth v proſperitie certain iob oftentymes bin waked trumpet ſaye eſtate hee bin vtterly confounded ſoone god afflicted vvherefore let v take heed walk feare trembling chiefly wee ſee god ſendeth v wordly proſperitie tyme diuell watcheth narrowlieſt ſurprize v caſt ſome temptation v neuer thought thus yee ſee wee haue marke vpon ſentence ſayd time iob ſo well ſettled ſeemed ſo many bulwarkes euill could touche one momente lighnings heauen whirlewynde ayre enimies ſtripped al ſo brought vtter extremitie ſauing perſon god reſerued ſtill greeuous temptation reſidue let v returne ſentence haue touched alreadie wit know rage satan agaynſt faythfull vvee haue ſeene heretofore god holdeth ſhorte ſaying thou ſhalt touche perſon iob herewithall wee ſee furiouſneſſe hee hath proceeded let v conſider meanes hath torment v looke many infirmity haue looke howe many kindes aduerſityes world looke many ouerthwart thing againſt v ſo many ſharp dartes satan hath euer readineſſe agaynſt v ſo many woundes deadly ſtrypes able giue v god prouide otherwiſe ſeeing diuell hath continually ſuche weapon ſide altogither naked pray ſhoulde become v god remedie much therfore haue cauſe render thanks god ſeeing perceyue sathan doo hee giueth leaue doe therewithall haue neede alſo call vpon god continually ſay ala lord vnder thy protection ſhall become v vve bee ſure thou chaſtizeſt v time therwithall thou ſheweſt v thy fatherly goodneſſe thou ſuffereſt v vtterly rooted cōſidering outrageouſneſſe enemie haue doo ſhuldeſt thou giue brydle agaynſt v muſt needes deuoured ſodeynly euen one poore ſillie ſheepe among hundred thouſand woolues vve ſee ought kepe good warde watch ſtande vpon guarde pray vntoo god ſuffer v left vp pray vnto satan satan durſt ſo hardie offer battell sauior world according ſee lord ieſus chriſt aſſailed wee may ſure hardie runne vppon v therfore let v take armour god hath giuen v reſiſt withall worde whervnto saint paule ſendeth v meaneth arme v thoroughly agaynſt temptation worlde diuell let v receyue god giueth v wee negligent helpe ſelues meanes putteth hand may ſuccour ſelues neede thus wee ſee wee haue ſumme remember concerning leſſon wee take profite ſhewed v example iob wayting till reſidue ſet large let v fall downe face god acknowledgement offence praying make v vnderſtand thē better yea euē ſuch wiſe afflicteth v wee may aſſure ſelues ſinnes offence therewithall knowe mortifie v worldward drawe v continually himſelf making v paſſe affliction muſt ſo much ſweete amiable vnto v whē ſee tēd welfare furthermore wil giue v grace ſo mortified may deſire nothing bee ſubiect ſuche wiſe obeyſaunce may neuer ſwarue perſeuer euē vntil haue drawne v eternall reſt may pleaſe giue thys grace vnto v alſo people nation c ſeuenth sermon vpon first chapter 20 iob roſe vp rent clothes ſhore head caſt himſelfe grounde vvorſhipped 21 ſayd naked came mother vvombe naked ſhall returne againe lord hath giuen lord hath taken avvay bliſſed name lorde 22 iob ſinned ne charged god vvith vnreaſonableneſſe wee well ſaye pacience great vertue deede yet verye fewe knowe worde pacience meaneth whereby man maye iudge wee bee verie haſtie pacient haue vertue eſteme ſo much god perceyuing ſuch careleſneſſe mē mindeth ſet eies thing ſo need full v pacient fayth muſt needes vaniſhe away ſhe able mainteyne hir ſelfe without foraſmuch ſo god middes miſeries worlde wee ſhoulde alwayes haue quiet heart bee ſo well aſſured goodneſſe ſame may make v mery contented may boaſt ſelues agaynſt satan enimies poſsible looked higher worlde ne conſidered although eſtate miſerable opinion fleſh yet ought contented ſeing god loueth v preſent text excellent holy scripture ſhewe v woorde pacience importeth behoueth v bee taught wee haue god acknowledge v paciente oure affliction vve commonly ſay man pacient although hee haue poynt true pacience whoſoeuer ſuffereth aduerſitie doo men call pacient way let v holde rule pacient behoueth v moderate ſorrow aduerſitie muſt bee aſſuaged conſidering god ceaſſeth procure welfare continually ought ſubiect vntoo good reaſon ſhould gouerne v according good pleaſure lo wherin pacience ſheweth ſelfe nothing better behouefull looke vpon glaſſe ſette v vvee haue ſeene iob might haue bin ouerwhelmed report ſo manye euill tydings ſayd roſe vp rent clothes polled heade caſte himſelfe vpon grounde humble himſelfe afore god wee ſee firſt ſuch pacient ſure ſome griefe ſo feele great ſorrowe anguiſh hart block wood ſtone vertue v man worthy prayſed hath feeling aduerſitie vvee ſee ſometimes poore madman laugh ſcorne whole worlde yea euen deathes doore bicauſe hath feeling miſerie therefore deſerueth taken eſteemed vertue rather blockiſhneſſe brute beaſts haue ſometime feeling yet pacient let v marke worde pacient pacientneſſe betokeneth mē ſhoulde become blockiſhe ſo ſhould haue heauineſſe combered griefe feele aduerſities vertue moderate themſelues holde ſuche meaſure ceaſe glorifie god middeſt theyr miſeryes bee ſo ouercombred ſwallowed vp ſorrowe anguiſhe quaile altogither fight againſt owne paſsions vntill maye bee able frame themſelues good god conclude iob doth finally ſay righteous reſpects let v ſee wee haue marke ſaide iob rent garmente ſhore hys head ſuch faſhions cuſtomable eaſt country according knowe mo ceremony thoſe countryes theſe colde country dwell happened thing might moue men great trouble rent theyr garment token ſorrowe marke ſpeciall poynt lykewiſe countrey men wont weare long head polled themſelues mourned like contrary part men vſe poll heades let heare growe make ſorrowe therefore iobs rending hys garment polling heade token heauineſſe conceyueth certaine vpon hypocriſie oftentimes meane counterfeit diſguiſe themſelues ende men ſhould thinke bee great heauineſſe ceaſſe laugh heart iob vſed ſuch hypocriſie let v aſſure ſelues tare garment ſhore heade full extreme anguiſh ſorrowe hee caſt himſelfe grounde ſame another lyke recorde thereof ſeemeth iob gaue brydle heauineſſe fault condemned know men wont exceſsiue inordinate paſsions though reſtreine repreſſe thēſelues much yet ceaſſe paſſe meaſure nothing hard moderate man ſelfe ſuch wiſe wee may keepe rule compaſſe ſee men cannot make mery excepte ouer mery sorrowe heauineſſe paſsion yet farre headdie carying men awaye wyth farre greater force gladneſſe doth therefore haue cauſe ſtande vpon guard oftentimes long god ſhall ſende v aduerſitie thing wherein wont ouerſhoote ſelues moſt ſayde iob rent garment ſeemeth hee ment pricke himſelfe forwarde bee ſorrowfull man beholdeth himſelfe ſo defaced aſtoniſhed himſelfe afterward whē came eare man might ſaye hee ſoughte helpes ſharpen increace griefe much ſtrike ſpurres owne ſides haue ſayde may ſeeme woorthie condemned firſt muſt vnderſtand ſcripture purpoſeth expreſſe ſorrowe holy man ſo great ſo vehement able ſtaye himſelfe vſing ordinarie faſhions yea euen tearing hys garment ſhew felt ſuch anguiſhe wounded euen bottome hys hart ſcripture ment expreſſe way although men ought ſtande vpon guarde ſwallowed vp ſorrowe bee afflicted yet notwithſtanding god ſendeth v aduerſitie meete ſhoulde thinke vpon common faſhion putting awaye griefe ſtarke naught yet wee ſee howe men haue falne inſomuch haue ment haue pacience haue quenched conſideration theyr miſſehaps thruſt farre chaſed quite away ſhort haue labored ſo brutiſh might know diſcerne thing cleane contrarywiſe god ſcourgeth v giue v blowes head beetle ende wee ſhoulde aſtoniſhed caſt ſwound mind induce v thinke vpon miſeries beſides ought call ſinnes remembrance craue pardon bee ſo much warer afterwarde walke becommeth v inſtructed alſo life ende ſhould haue ouerliking puffed vp vanitie preſumption rather acknowledge bond ſtand bound god vſing v ſo gently cary v lappe finally foraſmuch ſee hath care life wee ſhoulde looke great way afore v ſay keepe way ſtill euerlaſting kingdom wher true ioy reſt vve ſee god ceaſſeth bee mercifull vnto v ſendeth affliction vnto v doth ende trying v alſo might knowe eſtate moreouer good profitable faythfull god afflicteth ſhoulde enforce themſelues thinke wherefore thus afflicted ſay meete think vpon theſe thing ſee iob could rend hys garment ſheare head without offending god intended thereby caſt himſelfe ouergreat heauineſſe doings tended humilitie like alſo ſame ſigne repentance among men olde tyme god ſent plague warre among clothed themſelues ſackcloth caſt duſt vpon heades vvhy ſo feede euill ſorrowe whereof ſaint paule ſpeaketh ſaith manner worlde muſt eſchue fault another ſorrowe whiche affirmeth godly men acknowledging themſelues wretched ſinners doe come iudge condemne themſelues ſhewe worthy cōfounded clotheth himſelfe ſackcloth caſteth duſt vpon heade witneſſeth hath thing wherof glory muſt holde mouth ſhut ſo cace already buried faine ſay worthy go vpon earth meete earth ſhould vpon god ſhould caſt ſo lowe might trampled vpon men feete thus ye ſee howe iob behaued himſelfe vvhen hee ſawe god called lowlineſſe contented frame himſelfe hys good ſame cauſe rent clothes ſhore head hereby perceyue haue touched alredie pacience without griefe therfore behoueth god child bee ſad feele theyr owne ſorowes yet ceaſſe haue vertue pacientneſſe reſiſt owne paſsions ſuch wiſe conceyue hartburning agaynſt god paſſe meaſure ſorrowing kicke agaynſt ſpurre rather giue glorie vnto god followeth immediately texte iob cast himſelfe vnto earth worſhip god true woorde whiche ſette heere ſignifyeth incline bowe downe man ſelfe meaning humble himſelf god reuerence vvee ſee many caſt themſelues ground al ceaſſe rage ſuch wyſe poſsible would mount aboue cloudes giue battell vnto god ſee ſome alſo caryed away rage bicauſe cannot ruſhe againſt god would cō trariwiſe iob caſt himſelfe earth purpoſe worſhip god hauing ſpeciall eye vnto humble himſelf high maieſtie feele god hand intent ſhould reuerence haue done afore surely god handle v gently ought moue v come according allureth v vvherfore vſeth great goodneſſe purpoſe draw v vnto foraſmuch wee bee ſo loth come faine ſummon v ſhew authoritie hath ouer v like whē prince ſeeth ſubiect ſlow dutie ſendeth officer ſummon alſo god perceiuing paſſe comming vnto rather come ſo willing earneſt affection requiſite prouoketh v ſummoneth v iob therfore knowing ende true vſe affliction caſt himſelf ground purpoſe reuerence vnto god ſay lord true haue ſerued honored thee heretofore tyme haue flouriſhed bene chiefeſt tryumph haue pleaſure thee ſeruice haue knowne myſelfe inough ſee frailtie v wretched creature therefore lord come nowe mine homage newe againe thee ſeeing pleaſeth thee afflicte mee world lord willingly yeld ſelfe vnto thee deſire nothing put ſelf ſubiect thy hand howſoeuer world go thus much concerning ſaying iob caſt himſelfe ground purpoſe worſhip god nowe let v come whiche ſaide wit iob acknowledged men naked came mother wombe naked ſayth ſhall returne againe vvhereas hee nameth mother wombe hee meaneth another thing witte wombe earth mother thing elſe man pinched heart hee vttereth word full cutteth halfe according ſee ſuch extremitie ſorrow expreſſe wordes full neuertheleſſe proteſtation cleere inough wit iob ment ſay thus well muſt faine return earth euen ſame plyght came oute mother wombe true man maye take ſaying two way firſt generall ſentence behold men come naked world paſſe come ſame point againe brought ryches theyr honoure theyr pompe pleaſures muſt fain go away rottenneſſe earth muſt receiue expoſition agreeable namely iob applyed ſayde ſentence hys owne perſon ſhould ſay came naked mother womb hath bin god pleaſure enrich tyme ſo haue great heards cattell great houſhold goodly ſort chyldren ſhort gloriouſly decked benefit bleſsings god beſtowed vpon wil ſhal go hence ſtarke naked hath enriched al theſe thinges taketh thē away intent ſhould returne fyrſt ſtate diſpoſe ſelfe creepe foorthwith graue ſentence well worthy bee marked iob coulde make better proofe pacience determining bee ſtarke naked ſyth god good pleaſure hee ſhoulde bee ſo true men haue fayre excuſes force nature ſpyte teethe muſte bee fayne returne naked theyr graues euen paynim haue ſayde thing deathe whiche ſheweth howe ſmall thyng man vvhy ſo wee haue gulfe couetouſneſſe v ſo wee coulde finde heartes ſwallowe vppe whole earth man haue plentie ryches vyneyardes meddowes poſſeſsions ſuffyſeth god muſte bee fayne create newe worldes v hee mynde ſatiſfye v yet bee wee deade wee muſte haue ground oure owne lengthe wherein rotte conſume awaye nothing death ſheweth wee bee oure nature yet neuertheleſſe yee ſhall ſee many ſtriue againſt neceſsitie make gorgeous tombes haue triumphant funeral ſhould ſeeme ſuche men coulde finde heartes reſiſt god attayne theyr purpoſe truely ſuche generall ſtate man v becommeth v ſuffer paciently loſſe goodes ryches ſo euer wee bee berefte ſay becommeth v ſuffer god ſtrippe v euen oure bare naked skynne prepare oure ſelues returne oure graue ſame ſtate beholde ſaye wherein wee maye proue oure ſelues bee pacient iob ment ſentence alſo ofte long wee wante goodes worlde indure hunger colde bee nipped anye aduerſitie haue reliefe let v thinke v oure byrthe let v conſyder ſelues bothe wee bee whence wee come men abuſe fatherly care god hathe prouiding thinges whiche haue neede true ought haue leſſon wel imprinted oure hearte namely god wyll haue v wante anye thing hathe put v worlde wythout mynding nouriſhe v yet muſte wee alwayes acknowledge ſame commeth elſewhere ſelues may thinke wee haue thinges owne right wee holde free goodneſſe god man ſhould fynde mee owne free coſte ſay vnto mee come dayly mee thou ſhalte haue thus muche wyne thus much breade intertaine thee beit bynde ſelfe thee gyue thee freely woulde herevpon holde plea againſt bynde whoſe hande ought begge euery daye whoſe hande receyue ſubſtaunce make rente whiche hee gyueth mee hys free lyberalitie ſhoulde bee verye heynous vnthankefulneſſe ſhoulde deſerue ſpitted face therefore muche wee bounde receyue god benefites modeſtie aſſuring ſelues oweth v thing much wee bee poore becommeth v repayre vnto begge endleſſe liberalitie euery day ſoeuer wee bee driuen neceſsitie lette v haue recourſe backe haue ſayde examine whence came i▪ euen mother wombe ſtarke naked poore wretched creature able helpe ſelfe ridde mee pouertie wherein ſo muſt needes haue periſhed altogither ben ſuccoured others ſo pleaſed god foſter mee intertayne mee euen houre gyue mee gracious benefites without number therfore pleaſe ſcourge good reaſon ſhould beare paciently ſeeing commeth hande thus yee ſee wee haue marke vppon whyche iob ſheweth v ſaying naked came mother wombe naked ſhall returne agayne graue fynally god gyueth goodes intoo handes wee imagine wee ſhall poſſeſſe ſome long tyme ownerſhip ſhall contynue v wee ſhall ſo accompanyed wyth oure ryches ſhall goe v oure graue ſhall neuer departe v lette v make ſuche accompte deceyue oure ſelues contrarywyſe lette v aſſure oure ſelues bee god good pleaſure take away goodes hee hath lente v whither bee nighte morrowe wee muſte bee readye forgoe hee dothe v wrong bereaue v one minute houre wee coulde get oure whole lyfe concerning reſydue iob leadeth v yet ſaying god gyuen god taken awaye name lorde bliſſed therefore vvhen hee ſayeth god gyuen hee ſheweth howe good reaſon god ſhoulde haue diſpoſing thinges hee hathe put intoo oure handes ſeeing bee god ſendeth v ryches hee releaſeth owne right hee ſhould haue ſoueraintie hee ought haue maker world worde maker importeth hee hath made thing ſuche ſorte meete power ſouerain dominion ſhould remain vnto ſelf albeit men poſſeſſe portion according portion good hath giuen world yet meete ſhould ſtil continue lord maiſter iob therefore knowing ſubmitted himſelfe wholly god good thing v confeſſe moſt rightful notwithſtanding meane whyle man willing frame himſelfe thereafter proofe heereof god giue v leaue ioy two three dayes benefite wee thinke hee doth v great wrong hee take v againe wee grudge agaynſte ſo dooing meaneth ſame vnthankfulneſſe ſpake euen nowe namely god hathe ſhewed himſelfe lyberall v owne free goodneſſe wee opynion hee ought neuer fayle v ſo euer wee doe lo ſentence common ynoughe talke howbeeit ſo yll practiſed man may well ſee vnderſtoode fewe much behoueth v conſider meant thys ſaying lorde hathe gyuen lorde hathe taken awaye wee may know maner authoritie lord hath giue v enioying benefit alſo take away v euery minute houre pleaſure heere ſee sainct paule exhorteth v foraſmuch ſhape world paſſeth away thing therin glide vaniſhe awaye wee ſhoulde poſſeſſe wee poſſeſſed ſaye ſhould haue mynds tied ſaide another place muſt ſettle ſelues vpon vncertaintie ryches god ſhall haue bereft v gaue v wee muſt always ready ſay iob well thou lord haſt vſed thyne owne right thou haſt gyuen thou haſt taken away thy pleaſure thus yee ſee effecte ſtreine namely often whenſoeuer wee thinke vpon goodes worlde wee muſt alwayes beare mynd hold god vpon condition feeſimple ſo ſhould pretend title bee maiſter vpon condition pleaſe put intoo oure handes hee may alſo plucke v hee thinkes good let v vnderſtand wee ſo much bound cauſeth v enioy ſome benefite daye moneth ſome ſpace time muſt thinke ſtrange bereaue v afterward haue recourſe ſaid knowledge haue ſpoken namely god dothe euermore holde ſuch ſuperioritie ouer v hee may diſpoſe hys owne hee lyſteth hymſelfe bee lawfull mortall menne diſpoſe goodes liſte themſelues ought wee graunt much lyuing god seeing god ought haue maiſterſhip onely ouer thinges wee poſſeſſe alſo ouer oure owne perſons ouer chyldren let v humble oure ſelues afore ſubmit oure ſelues wholly holy without gainſaying yea verye fewe yeelde ſo muche honor vnto god true men eaſily ſaye god hath gyuen poſſeſſe chalendge ſelues vaunte ſelues ſpyte praye anye better flatte mockerie yea verelye groſſe hypocriſie wee haue proteſted hold thing god yet notwithſtanding wee meane nothing leſſe hee ſhoulde haue diſpoſition hee ſhoulde chaunge anye thing wee woulde haue let v alone ſet v free libertie ſeparated exempted iuriſdiction muche manne ſhould ſay well contented acknowledge ſuche one prince wil doe mine homage alegeance vnto howbeit ſo enter houſe ſo hee come demaunde anye thing hande ſo hee trouble mee worlde coulde beare ſuch vilanie yet neuertheleſſe ſee howe men dallye god wee meane confeſsion wee holde meane whyle abyde hee ſhoulde touch thyng vvee ſee worlde doth openly playe mockholyday god yet becommeth v alwayes follow ſhewed v wit foraſmuche god hath gyuen v poſſeſſe may call backe againe withdraw v yet added byandby namely name god ſhoulde bliſſed importeth heerein iob ſubmitteth hym ſelfe ſuche wyſe vntoo god hee confeſſeth bee good iuſte notwithſtanding ſcourged ſo roughly hande haue ſayde importeth bycauſe euery man may graunt power ſoueraintie vnto god may ſay well ſeeing hath gyuen hee may alſo take meane whyle hee acknowledge god dealeth iuſtly good reaſon ther many bee ſcourged doe blame god crueltie ouergreat roughneſſe ſo reſerue vnto right withdrawe thing hee hath giuen conſider haue ſayde afore poſſeſſe goodes condition maye ſtripped day morrowe fewe haue conſideration reſt quietly vpon confeſſe nothing better ſubmit thing god maieſtie acknowledge ſhould let v follow owne ſway way v confuſion hee gouerne v according bee profit welfare lo wherevnto behoueth v come alſo ſee muche imported ſentence ſayde bliſſed bee name lorde wee muſt onely picke word alſo conſider mynde proceede ſpoken truly vnfaynedly howe poſsible wee ſhoulde bliſſe name god wee doe firſt acknowledge rightuous hee grudgeth againſt god though cruell vnkynd curſſeth god bicauſe much lyeth hee lifteth himſelfe vp againſt acknowledgeth god bee father himſelfe god chyld ne yeldeth recorde goodneſſe bliſſeth god ſo taſt mercie grace god ſheweth men afflicteth muſt needes grynd teeth caſt vp vomit oute ſome poyſon againſt therefore bliſſe lordes name importeth much perſuade ſelues iuſt rightfull owne nature alſo good mercyfull lo howe may bliſſe god name example iob acknowledging iuſtice vprightneſſe moreouer alſo grace fatherly goodneſſe towards
