v ſee alſo text addeth concluſion al theſe thing iob ſinned charged god anye vnreaſonableneſſe vvorde worde thus iob dyd laye afore god put vpon god vnreaſonable thing maner ſpeaking well worthie bee marked vvhereof commeth men martyr ſelues ſuche wyſe god ſendeth thing cleane contrarie theyr deſire knowe god doth reaſon hath iuſt cauſe ſo well printed heart thing god dothe grounded vpon good reaſon certaine woulde aſhamed encounter doe conſidering ſaye knowe hath iuſt occaſion diſpoſe thing ſuch wiſe ſee nowe purpoſely ſayde iob imputed vnreaſonable dealing vnto god ſaye imagined god doe thing iuſt vpright marke ſpeciall poynt behoueth v marke theſe wordes vnto god verye muche implyed conſider horrible matter talke god workes ſuche ſorte wee doe god ſende v ſo euer wee wyſhe wee fall reaſonyng wyth hym wee holde plea wyth hym wee ſeeme doe ſo deede ſelfe ſheweth ſo neuertherleſſe vvee haue eye euerye blowe ſaying howe commes paſſe mynde ſpoken euen venemous heart man ſhould ſaye matter ſhoulde haue gone otherwyſe ſee reaſon ſhould 〈◊〉 ſo meane whyle god condemned among v beholde howe menne ruſhe without theyr boundes one ſhoulde accuſe god bee either 〈…〉 nt brainleſſe perſon ſeeketh nothing bring 〈…〉 confuſion lo horrible blaſphemie followeth euery blaſt men mouth yet conſider yet ſo great mater hath pleaſed holy ghoſt teach v mynd giue glorie vnto god bliſſe name becommeth v muſte fully perſuaded god doeth anye thing without reaſon let v charge nother crueltie ignoraunce though hee thing ſpyte randon let v acknowledge poynts reſpects procedeth wonderfull iuſtice exceeding great goodneſſe infinite wiſedome ſo nothing vpryghtneſſe equitie doings true remayneth one point debate wit howe iob acknowledged god bee taker awaye thing ſpoyled theeues whiche ſeemeth ſtrange thing vnto v much time ſerue declare nowe wee reſerue till morrow ſhall ſuffice ſhew wee bee afflicted wee muſte thinke happeneth withoute reaſon rather god hath iuſt cauſe therefore wee troubled greeued muſt haue recourſe vnto praye graunt v grace know nothing befalleth v worlde ordinance yea aſſured diſpoſeth thing ſuch wiſe turne continually welfare wee haue maner knowledge make v beare paciently affliction hee ſendeth vpon v alſo ſerue humble v hath made v taſt fatherly goodneſſe ſhall deſire nothing gloryfye meanes well aduerſitie proſperitie let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying hym ſo brydle v may ouerſhoote oure ſelues vayne imagination rather knowing benefit welfare lyeth may come ſeeke reſting oure ſelues wholly vpon mercie hath made v taſt wee may ſo fully perſuaded loue whiche beareth v although hee cauſe v walke many trouble aduerſities worlde yet wee maye neuer ceaſſe cleaue faſte hym continually walke feare obedience vntoo hym vntill hee haue rid v mortall bodye oute impryſonment bondage ſinne wherein wee bee gather v vp intoo heauenly glory ſhal haue let maye reioyce god partaker glory goodes graunt grace onely v alſo c eight sermon first vpon ſecond chapter sermon contayneth ende former chapter lord hath giuen lord hath taken away c alſo followeth ſecond chapter 1 befell day child god preſented themſelues lord▪ among came satan alſo preſent himſelfe lord 2 lorde ſayde satan vvhence commeſt thou satan aunſvvered lorde ſayde going vvalking vpon earth 3 lorde ſayde satan haſte thou taken heede ſeruaunt iob vvho hathe matche vpon earth ſounde vpright man fearing god vvithdravving himſelfe euill vvhich keepeth ſtill ſoundneſſe haſt thou ſought mee ende ſhould haue deſtroyed vvithout cauſe 4 satan anſvvered lord man vvill giue skin skin al hath ſaue life 5 novve lay thy hande vpon puniſhe fleſhe thou ſhalte ſee hee vvill curſſe thee thy face 6 lord ſayde satan beholde thy hande ſpare ſoule haue declared heretofore howe diuell beeing god mortall enemie hee deede fayne yeelde obedience maker whome ſubiect doth willingly force ſo muche although diuell ſo ſore inraged anoy deſtroye whole world yet notwithſtanding whatſoeuer attempteth whatſoeuer deuiſe practiſe able bring nothing paſſe without god like satan hild awe ſo alſo wicked men world true paſſe bound far bear themſelues hand withſtand god wanteth good yet meane god accompliſheth thē ſo tooles wherwith worketh ſerueth purpoſe poynt well vttered v confeſsion iob maketh ſaith god giuen good that▪ poſſeſſed alſo taken away certain satan doer al rayſing horrible tēpeſt ſpoyling iob ſubſtance killing child vvherfore imputeth theſe thing vnto god specially ſeeing wee haue ſeene heeretofore theeues robber ſpoyled hys goodes meete god ſhould bee vttered authour ſuch theeuing robberie ſhould ſeeme ment wrap ſinnes men cannot excuſe came inuade good cattell iob vve ſee theeues may condemne yet notwithſtanding iob ſayeth satan hath ſo wholly ſpoyled mee bee theeues haue robbed ſayth god hath done doth iob blaſpheme god ſaying ſo god alloweth ſaying haue ſeene alreadie charged god vnreaſonable dealing hath confeſſed god rightuous full equitie hath gloryfyed meete yet neuertheleſſe ſaith flatly god dooer thing whiche theeues dyd dyuell doer nowe wee ſee heere howe god euermore ſoueraine degree guiding diſpoſing thing belowe leade ſuche ende hee thinketh good heere matter v iudge owne vnderſtanding ſome ouerweening perſons doe needes wyſe making god whole worlde ſubiect owne fanſie theſe beaſtes yea beetleheaded beaſtes bee haue neither knowledge wit yet purchaſe ſelues eſtimation ſaye ſee reaſon god ſhould doer thing ſhould authour ſin controll holy ghoſt ſpeaking ſo muſt need yeld man hath debated matter throughly fro hee muſt needes come ſayde concluſion namely comprehende greatneſſe heigth god dooings pleaſeth gyue v ſome taſt leaſtwyſe according oure capacitie whiche ouerſmall none knoweth god workes himſelfe alone bottomeleſſe depe ſcripture ſaith haue mean attain ſo muche ſearch ſhalbe confounded except goe reuerence lowlyneſſe therefore belongeth onely vnto god giue v knowledge howe wherfore doth therewithal behoueth v content ſelues ſcripture telleth v although ſeeme ſtraunge vnto v able comprehende oure capacitie reaſon yet muſt confeſſe god ryghtuous foraſmuch wee attaine let v tary comming latter daye time ſhall knowe parcelmeale dimneſſe sainct paule ſayth wee ſhall behold thing face face ſhewed v glaſſe thus wee ſee excellente texte ſhewe v howe god guydeth gouerneth whole worlde hys prouidence wee haue note purpoſe holye ghoſte telleth v god dothe nothing come paſſe without conſent ende wee myght deſpiſe sathan wicked menne wee ſee practyze inuente neuer ſo manye thinges bycauſe wee ſure able bring theyr enterpryſes see howe god meaneth aſſure v protection ſhewe v howe sathan ſo farre beeing mayſter himſelfe accompliſhe thing hee would hee fayne ſerue god tourne seeing caſe ſtandeth ſo lette v apply holie ſcripture ſuche vſe namely althoughe wee bee hemmed enemy rounde heere ſheepe woules throate yet notwithſtanding muſt ceaſſe truſt god warrant oure ſelues long vnder ſhadow wing ſhall ſure ſaluation howe ſo bycauſe hee hath ſoueraine dominion ouer al creature ſuch ſort holdeth euen satan himſelfe wicked perſons world awe leadeth thing ſuch iſſue thinketh good▪ lo whervpon ought ſtay maye call vpon god quietly wee haue called vpon aſſure ſelues hee guyde v heerewithall behoueth v beare mynd haue touched wit become iudges god ouergreat preſumption vvere diueliſh pryde men ſhoulde acknowledge god rightuous except could perceiue ſo would haue god humble abaſe himſelfe ſo muche u ſay wel ſee muſt accomptable thoſe aduaunce themſelues ſuch pryde al well worthy quite ouerwhelmed god yes certeſſe alſo wee ſee salomon ſayth whiche ouerinquiſitiue ſearching god maieſtie farre requiſite ſhall ouerwhelmed owne pryde ſo ſhall bee confounded remayneth nothing v haue ſayde ſobrietie praying vnto god teach v ſo much benefite behoofe receiue whatſoeuer ſaith good rightful pleading contrarie thus ye ſee howe ought proceede many men thinke themſelues haue gained muche haue founde ſome trifling cauillation vpholde that▪ god doth thinges doone sathan wicked men commonly alledged anſwere wicked folke doe anye euill god worketh onely ſuffereth ſimply giueth leaue ſeeing hee hath authoritie power let ſuffering permiſsion one hee himſelfe therfore fonde excuſe god hath neede oure leaſings maintayne truth ryghtuouſneſſe wythall vvee muſt finde ſuch ſtartingholes ſtoppe wicked folkes mouthes withall woulde ſpeake blaſphemie againſt god holineſſe inough haue whiche holie ſcripture telleth v god onely permitteth giueth leaue alſo executeth diuell wicked perſons appeareth scripture ſayth lorde thou haste permitted lorde thou haste doone like dauid confeſſeth ſinnes offence god puniſhed grieuouſly ſayth lord whome ſhall complayne ſee thy hande although dauid perſecuted wicked men yet called hande god beholde howe lorde himſelf ſpeaketh vvill wee bee wiſer hee shall make beleeue neede gaye coloures warrante man may offer reproch ſee ſpeaketh owne woorkes vvhen mynded puniſhe dauid rauiſhing bethſabee hee ſayde vnto thou haſt doone thing priuilye make sunne beare witneſſe howe vvhat god would vnto dauid abſolom ſhould rauiſh father wiues defile preſence people ſight sunne ye ſee inceſte horrible againſt nature yet neuertheleſſe god ſaith flatly thoſe word vve ſee ſingle leaue permiſsion▪ god himſelfe worketh ſuch wiſe wicked muſt needes bee inſtrumentes wee haue ſayd pray touching office iudge giue hangman leaue liſt vvhen iudge muſte ſet vpon offender giue ſentence according law conſcience beare hee ſay hangmā giue thee leaue go thou wilt man contrarywiſe hee peonounceth ſentence afterwarde according ſame putteth▪ offender intoo hangmannes handes doe execution vpon beholde god ſoueraine iudge worlde doe wee diſhonour hym ſaying hee doth giue sathan leaue doe li • teth much mocke god iuſtice peruert order yes doubt let v marke wicked runne ryot ſeeke nothing elſe put al confuſion god neuertheleſſe aboue guyding gouerning thinges ſuche ſorte nothing commeth paſſe without prouidence otherwyſe hee hath diſpoſed ſee expreſſely ſayde god wageth whiche caryed awaye owne ambition couetouſneſſe make warres cauſe trouble worlde hee entertayneth ſeruice hee termeth ſeruauntes ſeruaunt nabuchodonozor ſayeth hee maner one nabuchodonozor firſte formoſte hee idolater ſecondly wicked caytife deſired nothing ſheade mannes bloud turmoyle whole worlde muche hym laye neyther equitie vprightneſſe hym yet notwithſtanding god auoucheth bee ſeruant wyſe hee muſte onely permitte giue leaue beaſtlyneſſe talke ſo aſſes coulde ſpeake woulde behaue themſelues reaſonably thoſe pretend themſelues bee wyſe ſort nowe wee ſee howe god executeth commaundementes ordinance ſo yea erewithall lette v beare mynde euyll anye meanes bee fathered vppon hym sathan muſte beare blame ſtyll owne naughtyneſſe menne reproued condemned theyr owne conſcience whiche ſhall bee theyr iudge god ſhall bee gloryfyed hee doth howe vvee knowe thinges oughte bee eſteemed according intente ende men ame let v nowe conſider ſort god guydeth gouerneth thinges doone heere beneath true wee haue ſeene alreadye sathans deſyre nothyng elſe deſtroye bryng thynges ruyne god ſyde intendeth cleane contrarie ende woorkes called iudgementes ſo ſaying holie scripture one woorde alone meaneth take awaye lewde imagination myghte come oure myndes ſo marke iuſtifye woorkes god wit iudgementes rightfulneſſe proofe hereof god puniſheth ſuch haue offended hee able pleade againſt hee doth well moreouer meaning inure faythfull one pacience mortifye fleſhly affection teache lowlineſſe vvhat ſay wee theſe thinges wee condemne certayne take euen wickeddeſt men liue demaund whither bee lawfull god chaſtize mennes ſinnes tranſgreſsions whither belong vnto humble thoſe exercyſe obedientneſſe fayth tame end may lerne renownce world ſhalbee fayne glorifye god ſpyte teethe seing god leueleth marke foloweth work iuſt ryghtfull notwithſtanding men cauill againſt true wicked ceaſe grunte barke againſt god though cannot byte yet muſte nedes come paſſe dauid ſayeth one fyftith pſalme wit god ſhall bee iuſtifyed founde rightuouſe iudging without cauſe dauid ſpeaketh ſo hee knewe howe ſo ouergreat boldneſſe naughtineſſe men deſyre nothing lift vp themſelues againſte god caſte foorth woordes aduenture dauid therefore perceyuing ſuch malapertneſſe frowardneſſe worlde ſayeth verye well true creature paſſe boundes ſo far ſuch exceſſe god muſte needes bee blaſphemed put reproche creature become iudges yet ſhall found cleere vvhen men haue grudged fill againſt ende knitting vppe rightuouſneſſe appeare ſpight teeth let v maruel though murmuring againſt doctrine muſt needes ſo holy ghoſt hath prophecied ſo beforehand ſee let v walke ſingleneſſe mynde hold ſelues cōtented god declareth v concerning himſelf thus ſee ought practiſe ſayde leſſon therwithall let v hold faſt comfort giuen v let v fence oure ſelues wit sathan wicked folke worlde may lifte vp themſelues againſt v yet muſt paſſe vnder hand god execute ſhall bee perforce ſpyte teethe yet ſhall ſo bycauſe god hath ſoueraine preeminence ouer world well diuel wicked ſort ſubiecte nothing without conſent ſee ſayd againe sathan appeared among child god hym haue declared heeretofore sathan ment diſguyze himſelfe thorough hypocriſie hee myghte intermeddle himſelfe among angel hee fayne appeare god yeelde accompt doings thing one ſome place certayne scripture ſpeaketh ſo applye ſelfe oure rudeneſſe bycauſe wee conceiue howe thinges preſente afore god hee ſuche power preeminence nothing hidde vvhen vttered vnto v muſt acknowledge scripture applyeth ſelfe oure reaſon teacheth v ſuch meane moſt conuenient v moſte agreeable vnderſtanding god therefore lykened heere prince holdeth aſsyſes court whervnto men muſte come bee iudged thus yee ſee ſayde vpon certayne daye dyuell made hys apparance angelles lette v marke lyke god ſendeth angel guyde v miniſters welfare ſo bee handes inſtrumentes power maynteine v ſo alſo contrarie part ſendeth diuell vexe torment v knoweth ende hee doth true firſt may well bee aſtoniſhed ſee cauſe god doth whereby ſhall faith approued tryed glorifying god whereas wit end yet neuertheleſſe conclude euer proceedeth god rightfull iuſt nothing ſtedfaſtneſſe wayes thus mynded howe ſhall fayth allowed ſurely preſente ſtorie goodly inſtruction v behalfe vnleſſe wee conſider wherefore god intended perſecute ſeruant iob ſeeme v haue good cauſe complayne ſo god puniſhe wicked folke well done yea ſo gayneſay man walke vprightneſſe ſimplicitie dothe god delyuer sathans hande man ſaye hee dothe permitte ſuffer onely sathan ſo hys owne libertie conſydering howe outrageous hee wee alſo lefte vppe praye ſhoulde wee neceſsitie bee ouerwhelmed firſt puſhe contrarywyſe wee ſee howe god purpoſe haue pacience ſeruaunt made knowne althoughe hee haue reaſons whiche hidde v tyme yea euen oure lyfe long yet muſte wee holde oure ſelues ſhort confeſſe doth good yea though wee perceyue ende hee doeth albeit wee ſee neyther dyuels v yet angel yet muſt aſſure ſelues god ſendeth one verily maintayne v one ſyde trouble v ſo ſtandeth v alwayes hande knowe god hath iuſt cauſe chaſtize v hee ouerwhelme v hundred tymes daye well worthie yet haue ſayde alreadie god hath alwayes reſpecte vnto hee afflicteth v nowe satan ſhould torment v ſo intente wee might obtayne victorie agaynſte victorie ſhoulde bee ſo much honourable aſſayling v hath ben terrible alſo meaning exerciſe v practiſe intente wee maye ſtande awe take occaſion aduaunce oure ſelues ouerſleepe oure ſelues vayne ſelftruſt preſumption haue bene wont doe god wakeneth v ſuch wyſe wee perceiue vphyld hym woulde bee ſorowe ſpecially wee relieued ſo muche woulde bee chaunce fall ſtumble downe euery blowe therefore requiſite god ſhould put hande vnder v elſe falles woulde bee deadly therefore god wee ſhould feele aboue wee muſt vnderſtande angel haue ſpeciall care v guide v according god hath appoynted bee miniſters welfare committed v keeping hereby wee ſee called power principality meane whyle diuelles ceaſſe turmoyle deſtroye thinges neare thing happeneth without god howbeit done ende wee ſhould bee wakened inured temptation tryall ende wee may haue ſo muche greater excellenter victorie wee haue fought valiantly fynally ende sathan may gayne nothing oure hande ſo muche wee bee garded ſtrengthe aboue withſtande temptation lo haue briefly beare mynde concerning ſentence much hath bin expounded already hereto fore ſtande vpon briefly put remembraunce hath bene touched god demaundeth satan whence came satan telleth hath royled ouer whole worlde hath made vagary outleapes rounde touching iob asketh haste thou taken heede ſeruant iob heerein scripture yet agayne applyeth ſelfe oure rawneſſe god hath neede aske satan thing haue ſayde preſente wyth howbeit foraſmuche vnderſtande oure behoofe haue ſome ſuche maner ſpeeches wee better acquaynted god ſhoulde ſhewe himſelfe ſuche one hee owne infinite ſhould wee bee ſwalowed vp ſuch may conceiue ſuch may beare heerein wee ſee great goodneſſe towardes v whereas wee bee able come vp vnto hee commeth downe vnto v ende wee mighte knowe leaſte wyſe ſo farre foorthe oure profyte wee ſhoulde preſume enter intoo greate maieſtie wee ſhoulde bee ouerwhelmed wee bee able looke vppon sunne oure eye ſhall dazeled praye howe ſhall beholde glorye god full perfecteneſſe impoſsible v doe tyll wee bee made newe againe according sainct iohn ſayeth wee ſhall ſee wee become lyke vnto meane lette v contented child grace adoption ſealed oure heartes holie ghoſte conſequently lette v knowe image wherein ſheweth himſelfe vntoo v thus muche concerning hath bene touched namely sainct peter ſayeth sathan ceaſſeth goe aboute lyke roaring lyon whiche ſeeketh continually newe praye seeing ſo lette v keepe good watche ſtande vpon garde sainct peter hath threatned v wiſe hee addeth vvithſtand ſtedfaſtly faith hereby ſheweth v muſt afrayd although sathan haue ſuche power called prince world ſay neede afrayd ſhould ouerwhelme v ſo long armed faith ſhall haue ſtrength inough ſhall ſure victorie reſt vpon god leane vnto grace lorde ieſus chriſte wherof mention made tenth chapter iohn father ſayeth hee hath put hande ſtronger feare ye satan ſhall ouercome maker god hath put v handes oure lord ieſus chriſt intent ſhould good faithfull keeper ſoules body therefore let v reſt ſelues vpon yet let v ceaſſe ſtill ware carefull suche negligent ſhall fynde ſelues ouertaken euerie blowe ſureneſſe whiche wee haue god maketh v dull forget owne daungers wherein wee bee vpholdeth v wee quayle fyghting drouzie flatter themſelues deſpiſe god ayde relief lord ſayth hold vp afrayde although satan gyue charge vpon wyth thundring aſſaultes ſeemeth ſhall goe wrecke yet ſhall ye ſafe vnder vnder hande ſayth ſo meaning men ſhoulde preſume vpon themſelues goe contrariwiſe ſayeth come mee retire yourſelues vnder protection maye bee treſſe againſt deuiſe myſchiefe towardes ſyth fynd ſelues aſſayled ſo many enemy behoueth v ſo much knowe great neede wee haue god helpe vnder protection wee ſure neyther sathau wicked menne worlde bring thing aboute whiche haue enterpriſed agaynſt v let v marke howe diuell painted liuely vnto v holie ghoſt ſayeth hee ceaſſeth keepe courſes circuites earth ſtandeth v hande keepe always ſure watch euermore awake purpoſe pray vnto god haue recourſe vnto alſo arme ſelues faith may enter fielde battell fyght couragiouſly vntill ſuche time god graunte v enioye victorie hath promiſed v whereas ſayde heere iob god queſtioned sathan ſpecially token haue declared alreadie euen thoſe dayes hee fewe fellowes ſerued god purely heere ſee preciſely ſayde hee withdrewe himſelfe euill full corruption nothing elſe ouerflowing iniquity bene good ſtore rightuous menne world iob many like himſelfe giuen themſelues ſerue god hee god ſpoken one man alone heere ſayde expreſſely iob hee hath matche lyke wee bee warned marre ſelues wee bee among wicked perſons though wee ſee whole worlde ſette vpon miſchiefe turned vpſide downe wee muſt take example thereat ſuffer oure ſelues caried away keepe v ſtill right obedience vnder guidance god beſeching ſtrengthen v holie ſpirite heeles tripped vp ſtumblingblockes wee ſee diuell caſteth afore v thruſte v waye seing iob liued ſort ſoundneſſe notwithſtanding corruption world wer rife time corrupted let v mark although thing neuer ſo farre order wee muſt giue ſelues libertie doe euil wee muſte haue eye vnto god bee throughly ſetled walke preſence wee ſee recorde giuen holie father liued rightuouſly wit regarded men ſaye ſhall haue leaue much bee better neybours could ſaye beholde god ſeeth v howe wee walke worlde therefore muſt behaue ſelues muſte haue eye faſtned ſettled vpon haue tolde heretofore quality tytles importe whiche god gyueth vnto iob namely firſte hee ſayde ſubſtantialneſſe ſoundneſſe hearte true foundation wherevpon wee muſt grounde ſelues admit wee haue vertues worlde ſo wee bee prayſed honoured men wee ſeeme bee angel yet ſhal whole life dung ſtark filthineſſe god vnleſſe ſayd fountaine heart pure cleane according therevnto ſhall workes bee eſteemed therfore let euery man enter himſelfe ſearche owne conſcience may wel liked men almē may wel contented v yea maye clappe handes v yet wee ſhall neuertheleſſe curſſed afore god hypocriſie heart purged cleane diſsimulation ſo may bee doubleneſſe v two heartes scripture ſayeth place nowe ſo mynded ſerue god lyfe alſo anſwerable therevnto ſhall walke becommeth v vve ſee diuers woulde fayne bee taken ryghtuouſeſt folke worlde verie life ſheweth contrarie menne ſo good behauioure woonder ſee yea full mouth full eye full eares full feete full handes bee fullye dyuelles incarnate deadely▪ plague infecte whole worlde let v marke well▪ ſayd ſoundneſſe muſte bee matched honeſtie vpright dealyng ſo wee maye bee conuerſante among menne without anoying anye man indeuoring helpe oure neybours ſhewing friendlineſſe god commaundeth v ſee wherein ſhewe ſoundneſſe true toucheſtone whereby god proueth v like golde tryed either touchſtone furnace euen ſo ſoundhartedneſſe ſheweth ſelfe honeſt vpright dealing wee lyue among men without annoying without deſire drawe mennes goodes vnto v beeing voyde erueltie voyde pryde aud voyde vaynegloriouſneſſe contrarywiſe beeyng courtuouſe helpe euerie man pitifull ſuccoure ſuche neceſsitie diligente imploye ſelues according abilitie god gyueth v like behooueth v walke vprightly faithfully neighbour ſo behoueth v alſo feare god reaſon men ſhould haue right dutie god meane ſhould go without muſt begin according higheſt degree muſt ſuch wiſe apply ſelues ſeruing oure neighboures meane time god bee forgotten thing well worth marking ſomtimes ſhal ſee outward coūtenance vertue men ſo man would ſaye bee petie angelles man fynde faulte regard god rather deſpize therefore without cauſe god purpoſing heere commende ſeruante iob matcheth theſe two thing together namely liued vprightly among men alſo ſayde deuoutneſſe witte true mynde worſhip liuing god yet dwelled worlde among many corruption conſider ſoundneſſe wherein lyued ouerlazie reſiſt euils wherewith inuironed ſayde iob withdrewe ſelfe euill therefore let v thinke ſerue god without trouble wee ſhall prouoked doe euill ſides ſhall walke becommeth v behoueth v indeuer withdraw ſelues euill yea euen euill within v euill neere vnto v yet woulde ſtande v hand heedefull withdrawing ſelues ſmell ſtinche continently turne awaye face pray satan ſeeketh poyſon v full infection haue wee good cauſe withdrawe oure ſelues ſayde euill within v burning ouen looke howe many wicked luſtes bee carye v awaye ſo many aduerſaries god whole nature man ſayth sainct paule nothing elſe enmitie agaynſt god therefore behoueth v carefull put doctrine vre wit withdrawing oure ſelues euill howe ſhall withdrawe oure ſelues firſte let v take heede oure ſelues wicked affection ſerue turne v aſide god afterwarde let v beware leude perſons fyrebrandes ſet miſchiefe fyre theſe mortall plague nowe wee ſee ſo muche iniquitie ſo muche looſeneſſe ſo muche outrage worlde vice haue full ſcope▪ bee done let v withdrawe ſelues lette v ſhunne occaſion according alſo sainct paule alledgeth ſame recorde ſaying vvithdrawe ſelues •• ee farre babylon carrie lordes veſſels hereby paule meaneth baptized name lorde ieſus chriſte behoueth v bee holie body mynde bee gyuen wholly vnto god dedicated ſeruice whiche thing bee doone withdrawing oure ſelues defylementes maye corrupt v lette v eſchue occaſions euill wee ſee worlde ſo ouerflowed vice let v aduiſedly withdraw ſelues faſten eye vpon god maketh v holy nowe oure lorde addeth tytle hee vſed afore iob kepte ſtill ſoundneſſe herein oure lorde commendeth conſtancie whiche apparant vntill ſuch time hee beene wounded quicke iob heretofore bene man feared god hee bene ſounde hee ſayde ſubſtancialneſſe ſpake hee foreſayde honeſt vpright dealing conuerſation neyghbours truely verye much hym haue ſo many goodly vertues yet knowne ſuch conſtancie holde ſoundneſſe nowe iob bereft goodes hee hath loſte child yet hee bliſſeth name god acknowledging hee ought liue vnder condition god giue goodes vſe afterwarde take againe hee ought prepare himſelfe nakedneſſe myſerie kicke againſt hathe power authoritie lo heere inuincible conſtancie knowne bee iob whiche heeretofore ſuche tryall heereby wee ſee neceſſarie v be▪ afflicted although wee fynd harde paynefull firſt ſighte yet behoouefull v ſo wee thinke vpon god helpe becommeth v vntill wee haue trauelled thorough many daungers hath bene chaunce get vpper hande ouer temptation then▪ lette v marke well lyke god hath told v iob kept ſtil ſoūdneſſe notwithſtanding ben ſore perſecuted ſo alſo muſt paſſe ſame gate wit muſt continuall readyneſſe ſerue god giue oure ſelues wholly vnto notwithſtanding wee bee tryed diuers ſortes wherefore euen holde ſtill oure ſoundneſſe vve ſee howe needefull euerie one v ſhould ſo exerciſed ende one ſyde wee may knowe neede wee haue god helpe ſyde ſay maye better tryed power holie ghoſt ſhewe vtter ſelfe better v getting vpper hande temptation battelles put vnto v satan god graunt v bee armed aforehande ſayde heauenly vertue conſtancie wythſtande incounters vntill haue full victorie wee ſhall gathered ouerlaſting reſt heauenly kingdome let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes beſeeching make v feele better intent crauing pardon hande wee may rightfull ſory diſpleaſed oure ſelues therewithall wee may bee ſo foreſtrengthened holy ſpirite diuell may able gayne thing handes wee may get victorie againſt againſt whole worlde againſt oure fleſhly affection ſo let v ſaye almightie god heauenly father c ninth sermon ſecond vpon ſecond chapter 7 satan vvent preſence lorde ſmote iob vvith euill ſore ſole foote crovvne head 8 tooke potſherd ſcrape himſelfe ſate dovvne duſte 9 vvife ſayde vnto doſt thou yet holde ſtill thy ſingleneſſe bliſſe god die 10 anſvvered hir thou ſpeakeſt like fooliſhe vvoman vvee haue receyued good lord ſhall vve receiue euill iob ſinned vvith lippes haue marke heere whē god hath withdrawne hande v wee muſt prepare oure ſelues ſuffer muche greater miſeries wee haue eſcaped ſee maner god proceedeth hee afflicteth ſeruantes nouices ſo bee acquainted ſuffering aduerſitie ſpareth like wee would laye ſo great burthen vpon litle chyld vpō man god hath regarde ableneſſe beare according practized induring trouble ſo ſendeth v ſmaller greater inured may better lay full lode vpon v hee hath alſo giuen v wherewith beare ſee ſpeaketh peter ſaying ſuch time yong lefte owne eaſe reſt thou art olde ſayth hee ſhal gird thee thou ſhalt tyed bound thou ſhalt haled whither thou wouldeſt vve ſee regarde god hath hold v vp yet tender afterward hath made v ſtrong hee ſendeth v greeuous heauie affliction much vſe ought haue ſtrengthened v alreadie aforehand hath bene ſhewed perſon iob ende euery v might receiue inſtruction hymſelfe right harde thing vnto iob ſpoyled good loſt child hee brought pouertie manner thing satan ſmote body ſo full paynefull botch whereof man coulde tell kinde ſauing one whole leproſie yea holy ſcripture ſheweth v neceſsitie diſeaſe muſt needes haue bin extreme lo heere caſt men company euen heretofore bene honored men heere rotten carion ſo muche hee like fall peeces yee would ſay owne ſtinch endure extremeſt payne world ſuche ſores coulde bee without great burning tormented euen vttermoſt ſee heere later miſerie farre exceſsiue miſeries happened vnto afore satan mente alſo ſayde▪ yea man alwayes quitte skinne skinne giue owne childe hys raunſome ſo may ſcape ſelfe hath ſaued owne life thinkes ſtill hath gayned muche although haue loſt yet hath wherewith comfort ſelfe aſſuage ſorrowe beholde ſuttleneſſe satan hee groundeth vppon nature man truely thys poynte founde iob yet caſe ſo ſtandeth v enclyned mind namely lyfe ſo precious vnto v eaſie v beare reſidue miſchaunces light vpon owne perſons ſo caſe ſtandeth ſee heere inuincible conſtancie ſeruant god continued hys ſoundneſſe god puniſhed goodes child alſo like perſecuted ſo roughly body hee one whole place full matter extreme greefe torment ſoeuer world went ceaſſed bleſſe god god graunt v eſcape ſome one inconuenience let v followe counſell haue gyuen afore learne diſpoſe ſelues ſuffering three foure moe whyche ſhall bee greater exceſsiuer firſte good reaſon god ſhoulde encreaſe weighte oure burden according ſtrength hath inabled v withall ſo hee hath eye oure welfare specially behoueth v marke well circumſtance iob long reſpite betweene continuall growing miſeries vppon hym god oftentimes gyue v ſome reſpite hee hath tryed pacience ſome aduerſitie wee may haue layſure take breath agayne aſſuage griefe heauineſſe wee haue endured afterwarde god ſendeth v ſome heartſore heere hee layd ſtroke vpon ſtroke aſſoone iob bene viſited one ſorte hys goodes wee ſee afflicted immediatly another vvhen robber made cleane riddaunce great cattell lightning came heauen conſume reſt child dyed hande god bene enemie plagued hys owne perſon heere inoughe haue ouerwhelmed iob notwithſtanding wonderfull ſtoutneſſe god wyll worke ſuche manner hym intente euery one v wee bee afflicted ſhoulde conſider god ceaſſeth bee father ſtill hee neuer forſooke ſeruaunt iob althoughe hee come ſuehe extremity wee ſuffer one halfe yea tenthe parte whyche endured ſhall wee bee excuſed murmure nay rather haue wee cauſe thanke god regarding oure infirmitie hee puniſheth v according whyche ſeeth v able endure letteth wee ſhoulde bee afflicted much iob god hathe ſo muche authoritie ouer v satan become gentle nowe dayes vve bee ſure rage mortall enemie satan ſelfe ſame hee ſame mynde ſtill hee keepeth ſtill accuſtomed nature witte bee lyon roaring open mouthe ſwallowe v vp god gyue hym brydle wee bee ſure ſhall endure muche iob affliction meane ſweete man compare affliction ſpoken heere therfore let v conclude god ſheweth hymſelfe curteous pitifull towardes v ſeeing chaſtized ſo gently hande hee keepeth ſuche meaſure bee racked vttermoſt vſeth ſo greate exceſsiue rigoure wee ſee heere perſon iob furthermore heere ſhewed v howe men oughte renounce themſelues may gyue ſelues wholly ouer vnto god long man ſtandeth owne conceyte yea euen though hee bee well accuſtomed ſerue god bee hee ſhall rather goe backward forwarde proofe whereof hee ſtandeth hys owne conceyte delighteth alſo owne pleaſures owne eaſe hee deſireth haue owne commodity luſt leadeth god meaneth handle v cleane contrarywiſe god delighteth trouble v bycauſe behoofefull v ſo tamed brought lowe may ſhewe ſubiection wee oughte yeelde vnto god god ſhould frame himſelfe thing ſendeth vpon v man could well diſcerne obedient handleth v cleane contrary appetite bee ſo ſubiect vnto holde affection vnder hys brydle ende frame ourſelues lure yeelde honor gouerning v yea euen hys owne good liſteth diſpoſe v therein wee ſhewe obedient thus ſee declared v text ſee iob fayne fighte againſt hys owne affection bereeue hymſelfe hold himſelfe priſoner▪ otherwyſe hee ſhoulde leape boundes ſhould lift vp himſelfe againſt god leaſtwiſe hee ſhoulde fall intoo ſuch anger hee ſhoulde nothing ſtorme within himſelfe ſo god ſhoulde haue nother credite ſuperioritie let v take example iob reſiſt affection bring vnderfoote intende ſerue god impoſsible hee ſhould haue ful vſe v til become point witte till wee renounce ourſelues ſet ſo much ſtore oure lyfe wee better finde harte yeelde ſelues ſubiect hym whoſe wee whome becommeth v dedicate lyfe ſo giuen owne commoditie eaſe true may well deſire god aſsiſt v ſende v ſo euer meete v but▪ yet therewithall wee muſt holde v ſtay namely hee may knoweth good though agaynſt appetite yet hee graunt v grace frame ſelues vnto folow hym throughout whither ſoeuer hee call v thing haue practiſe time lyfe vvhen trade occupation handicraft hard muſt haue time learne hath cunning belonging leſſon hard v learne yea ouerhard ſay v put vre true well ynough confeſſe good reaſon god ſhould bee chiefe mayſter reygne ouer v wee ſhould ſtriue againſt commeth deede fewe demeane themſelues thereafter therefore let v time lyfe learne remember ſayd leſſon inure ſelues vntill haue profited haue neede aſmuch ſhall bee handled large heereafter glaunce thinges paſſe lette v come added text witte iobs wife commeth prouoke deſpayre howe nowe ſayeth ſhe continueſt thou yet ſtill thy ſingleneſſe bliſſe god dye diuell findeth meanes ynow incomber v without hauing bellowes quicken vp fire wee know ſo great ſturdineſſe nature pitie ſee ſteade quiet ſubmitting ſelues vntoo god vnto holie ſpirit ought wee conceyue wandering imagination v hath whole ſtorehouſe full ſuch dotage brayne made drunken according knowe luſtes fleſhe enemy againſt god none v ouerſhooteth himſelfe though wee haue intycers prouoke v agaynſt god drawe v vnto deſpayre ſhort though satan take inſtrumentes without v deceyue v withall hee ſhall finde ynow within owne perſons enemy already within v haue ſayd wauering fancy vtter enemy god affection armed agaynſt make v ſtriue againſt puniſhments ſendeth vnto v therefore dubble warre vnto iob beſides poſsibilitie tempted himſelfe hys owne wife prouoked deſpaire full meaſure al miſerie god permitteth happen faithful one ineſpecially hee purpoſeth trye quicke lighted vpon iob alone wee ſee moſt dauid yea wee ſee alſo lorde ieſus chryſte beholde heere two mirroures wherein god mente repreſente ſaid kind temptation vnto v one greeuouſeſt complaintes dauid maketh mocked puttyng hys truſt god ſomuche hee became laughingſtocke euery man men bleared tung ſaying ſee la bare himſelfe hand ſate god lappe called protector buckler fortreſſe bragged calling vpon hym reſorting refuge bee ſhorte ſeemed god ſhoulde neuer haue forſaken hym▪ man may ſee howe hee hath eſteemed miſeries dauid endured ſo hard diſgeſt ne wounded ſo deadly theſe reproches men offered hym verely satan ſeeth holdeth v throte hee hath wonne thys poynte oure handes hee ſtandeth skanning whether hee may pricke v wounde v arme legge hee commeth righte hearte throate v hee hathe doone ſo muche wicked folke fall mocking v thoughe wee hadde truſted god vayne diſappointed hope wayted hys hande vve ſee faythe goeth vtter wrecke wee gyue place ſuche temptation looke befell vntoo dauid ſame accompliſhed oure lord ieſus chryſte therefore behoueth v hys member bee faſhioned lyke vnto hym ſame likeneſſe fulfilled perſons put ſelues readineſſe reſiſt indure aduerſities wicked perſons come ſting v ſcoffing faith purpoſe caſt v intoo ſuch deſpayre harte myght miſgyue v god agaynſte v cut ſhort truſt wee repoſed finde ſuccoure wee looked hande let v arme ourſelues agaynſte ſuche▪ temptation quayle vnder true haue erſt ſayde right harde temptation ouercome ſee written heere iob vphild ſtrong ynough helpe v alſo may quayle neuertheleſſe haue heere example satan hath tormented v wee haue bene viſited bothe body goodes thing el knit vp matter withall wee muſte bee fayne bee mocked haue fayth aſſaulted thys cannot bee done name god muſt bee blaſphemed therefore wee muſte needes bee grieued ſorie heart happeneth vnfaythfull skorne v reiected god blame vntruthe thoughe hee beguyled vs▪ therefore muſte needes greeue v torment v ſoeuer worlde goe let v faynte let v call remembrance hathe happened vntoo iob vntoo dauid ieſus chryſte hath ſhewed v ende wee may thinke ſtraunge wee bee faſhioned like vnto image heere wee ſee vpon condition god hath greffed v body ſonne ſo generall patrone faythfull saincte paule declareth viij romanes let v nowe conſider imported ſayde temptation iobs wyfe bringeth ſaying dost thou yet hold ſtill thy ſingleneſſe ſhe ſaid gayneſt thou ſeruing god thyne intent ſeruing hath bene bee ſupported hee ſhoulde haue lyked well thee hee ſhoulde haue ſhewed dooyngs hee thy father thou ſeeſt howe hee enemie thee perſecuteth thee thy ſoundneſſe booteth thee nothing lo heere hir concluſion concerning whyche followeth namely bliſſe god dye expounded diuers maners haue ſeene word bliſſe ſomtimes taken curſe cuſtome ſaye manner ſpeaking ſerueth teach v deteſt blaſphemie againſte god thing ought named done vnderſtand grudge againſte god ſpite caſt foorth word may ſound diſhonor ſo deteſtable thing muſt euen ſhudder quake according wee ſee sainct paule ſpeaketh againſt whoredome villainous looſeneſſe againſt gluttonie robberie let ſayth named among therefore ſome expounde ſentence thus bliſſe lord ſaye prouoke god anger thou dyeſt reuenge thy ſelfe ere thou dye thou ſeeſt well inough hath deceyued thee douted woman inſtrument sathan therefore bee maruelled though ſhe bee sheediuell feend hell ſette iob ſuch rage ſhoulde lift vp himſelfe againſt god fall ruſhing againſt maieſtie matter bee throughly conſidered naturall meaning rather bliſſe god dye ſay well mayſt thou perſiſt bliſſe god much thou wilt thou haſt done thou ſhalt gayne nothing loſt labour thou muſt fayne die thou canſt fully determined ſhall ſo thou ſeeſt god hath heard thy prayer whether thou glorifye one none ſhall come heauen therefore thou haſt ſpunne fayre threde humbling thy ſelfe afore god nay ſith thou muſt dye lyke poore forlorne caitife looke god ſhould appeaſed towards thee wrathe ſhould aſſuaged thou muſt needes paſſe true ſenſe commes continually one poynte therefore behoueth ſtande greatlye vpon wordes principall point haue ſuche doctrine holy ghoſt giueth v firſt poynte without difficultie word themſelues conteyne certayne marke whereat iobs wyfe ſhotte dryue deſpayre ende hee ſhoulde haue fretted chafed againſte god haue loſte whole vnderſtanding ſtede bliſsing god earſt done haue prouoked wrath finally haue flinged himſelfe ouer al fieldes lyke wood beaſte heere haue conſider throughly ſayd iob common inſtruction faithfull therefore let v beare well away apply owne vſe true ſaying heere came woman mouth many found ſay lyke thys daye ordinarie cuſtome world wee ſerue god adayes indenture ſay yea men themſelues aſhamed confeſſe owne vnbeleefe prouerbes ſay man ſhould truſt ſo much boughes let goe hys holde body tree much ſay muſt truſt altogither vnto god vvherevntoo tend theſe thing ſhewe wee yeeld honor vntoo god wee conceiue accordingly thing themſelues import god doo v good peraduenture may ſo ſhewe beholden handle v amiſſe incontinently tung end ſay purpoſe wee ouerlabour ſelues alſo let v marke well iob tempted prouoked owne wyfe satan ſhal haue ſtore vnderminers theſe dayes leade v intoo lyke temptatiō armed fenced reſiſt thus ſee haue doo beſides happen wicked come pricke v forward manner yet may euen haue profited moſt god ſchole may conceyue ſuch imagination themſelues vve ſee euen dauid confeſſeth himſelfe ſtoode vpon yce thought ſhould haue ſlyded entred intoo diſcourſe himſelfe ſaw wicked ſort oftentimes well intreated ſo glutted themſelues pleaſures world pyned away good men contrarye part poore faithfull one drinke water ſorow ſo god ceaſſeth puniſh vvherefore proteſteth ende hee came ſay haue indeuored haue cleane pure hand better loſte time vnprofitable labour dauid confeſſeth encombred ſuch temptation ouerthrowē came hee reſiſted ſtedfaſtly let v marke diuell bringeth ſuch match ſet v fire agaynſte god affliction muſt giue eare leaſt entrap v therefore muſt bethinke v leſſon long time aforehand whiche ſerueth gyue v victorie againſt ſuche encounter ſee wherefore ſayd eſay say ye reward rightuous ſaye conclude ſo ſelues vvhen ſee thing ſo confounded may ſeeme order turned vpſide downe god fauoreth wicked hateth godly rather fortune beareth ſway god ſleepe heauen gouerneth thing beneath yet muſt alwayes aſſure ſelues rightuous ſhall reape frute labour true worſe temptation thinke wee loſe labour ſeruing god prayſing name holding ſelues vnder hym therefore behoueth v fully perſwaded god wiſe diſappoint thoſe honour ſerue haue opinion impoſsible euer ſhould haue leaſt deſire bee world giue ſelues vnto god wee imagin god turneth backe vpon v hee make ſporte ſee v turmoyle ſo hee ſhutteth hys eye loſt time walke carefulnes bende himſelfe well foraſmuch behoueth thoſe ſerue god come neereſt vntoo hym bee fully reſolued hee rewardeth thoſe feare ſee woorſt deadlieſt temptation satan trumpe way beares v hand doo loſe tyme wee praye vntoo god make recourſe vntoo ſo much muſt wee watchfull againſte ſuch temptation perceiue bee ſo wicked daungerous herewithall let v beare mynd behoueth v ready fenced againſte greateſt freendes haue cace ſo heere may yeeld nother wyfe neighbour ſimply euen whome truſt beſt linking one another muſt ſuch wee alwayes haue regard god bond cōcord frēdſhip proceede alſo let v remember man haue diuell houſe diſquiet hee haue two three ſo much neede hath hee ſtande vpon gard may wiſe ſerue excuſe ſetting themſelues chafe againſt god declareth vnto v wee muſt gard ſelues ſydes ſo satan oure mortall enimie ouerwilye ſpieth ſide may beſt enter feeble place make breach eaſieſt entrance hath v loue husbande beareth wife ſingular freend vnto truſteth satan ſees well ynough gyue way ſuch manner perſons therefore laboreth earneſtly ſerue hys owne turne againſt v yet muſt diminiſhe frendſhips good godly husband muſt pray god ſuffer wife firebronde hell kindle fire impacience diſtruſt prouoke blaſpheme alſo behoueth wife pray god hir husband may guide hir cō uenient alwayes able inſtructe hir aright hir head ſuperioure moreouer god hath gyuen v freends acquaintance muſt pray hym may ſerue hys honoure ſo eche v maye way ſaluation entice one another vnto wickedneſſe thus ſee haue firſte poynte conſequently let v aduiſe ſelues well euery one wiues huſbands freends kinſfolke may helpe v ſerue god wee ſelues may ame alwayes marke ſpecially whē ſee god dwelleth vſeth owne hand guide v withall freend kinſman wife go driue v deſpaire peraduenture wee muſt renounce god muſt bee preferred frendſhip muſt begin leuell true mark haue marke ſtreyne according alſo iob ſheweth v owne example ſaying thou hast ſpoken lyke fooliſh woman verely haue receyued good hand lord ſhall wee alſo receyue euill vvhen iob anſwereth wyfe hath ſpoken fooliſhly thereby admoniſhed ought reproue ſuche blaſphemies ſharply aſmuche bee ſpewed satan ſee ſword drawen againſt v foyne caſt v wound v vnto deathe would behalfe would ſuffer ſelues ſlayne without making countenance thyng would take heede ſhift blowe ward ſet ſtore life euen ſo iob ſaw himſelfe ſo perſecuted owne wife ſhe wente worke ſome harme body ſende deepe pit hell reſiſted hir ſtoutly vve ſee corage ought proceede ſuche caſes dalying satan ſeing find ſo furious enemie going matter though went ſome light skirmiſhe eaſy ouercome furthermore iob alſo eye hath bene recyted heretofore haue ſayd man vpbrayd v vayn thing truſt god true ſame troubleth v ynough quench fayth therewithall god accuſed miſdealing mocking hys ſeruāts ſpecially vniuſtice proper plucked ſhall longer god except hee diſcerne good euill aduance thoſe ſerue ſoundneſſe ſo may iudge world ready heare reſort ſuccoure god bereft ſuch vertues ſee moſt certainly glory godhead quite aboliſhed iob could beare ſuch blaſphemies according alſo ſayd pſalme zeale god houſe ought bite hart conſume v reproch men offer vnto ought rebound vpon v ſo behoueth v grieued ſee honoure god impeached child becommeth v ſet ſelues againſt thus ſee haue note iob rebuked hys wife ſo ſtoutly ſay thou haſt ſpoken like foole herewithal let v beare mind anſwer ought made againſt like temptation partie ſoeuer come whence ſoeuer ſent v aboue wee bee troubled lewd imagination owne fleſh behoueth v folowe example iob learne howe deale owne griefes whereas wee haue bene accuſtomed angrie ſting v v wrong euery one v muſt begin ſtorme againſte himſelfe ſo may bethinke ſelues thus haue ſuch vice angry mine enemy one haue practiſed euill againſte haue pacience caried away deſire vengeance requite like like yet haue well aduiſed ſelfe find worſe enemie welfare thā ſelfe ſay vngracious nature wicked affection conceiue within many enimies hinder welfare therefore becommeth angry ſelfe bycauſe thence greateſt enemy come vvherefore ſuch temptation come vpon v ſee happened iob let v learne withſtand ſtoutly without ſoothing ſelues end may ouercome ſee ſelues trayned lewde fancy ſtriue againſt god nature full rebelliouſneſſe ſtriuing againſt muſt flatter ſelues ſay ſome nature wee bee able amend let v aſſure ſelues ſuch excuſes ſhall ſtand v ſteade behoueth v fight ſtoutly reſiſt v ſaye flatly muſt ſaue ſelues wote muſt enter combate yea liuely combate muſt employ witte endeuoure elſe ſhall neuer come ende lo whereof aduiſed ſtreine iob addeth seeing haue receyued good lorde ſhoulde alſo receyue euill ſetteth downe naturall argument induce v beare paciently euil aduerſities god ſendeth v wee bee ſo muche bounde man wee haue receyued good turne hys hand wil haue ſuch conſideration ſaye man hath done great good herevppon indure thing hand whome ſo muche beholden men ſaye villanouſe vnthankfulneſſe v according bound mortall men ſo alſo wyll pacient ſhall faine ſuffer inconuenience childe willing beare father foraſmuch hee knowes father begate nouriſhed kepeth ſtil hys houſe childe notwithſtanding father rough towards bound neuertheleſſe acknowledge good reaſon ſhould abide ſay graunt ſo much vnto creature muſt graunt creator vve ſee god doth v many good turnes ſhall endure euill hand pleaſeth ought haue ſuperioritie ouer v puniſh v thinketh good conſideration ought make v bowe downe neckes hold v quiet argument iob maketh heere hee ſayd heeretofore lord hath gyuen lorde hathe taken away another reaſon thereby hee ment god gyueth v good appropriate vnto v ſay let v haue vſe time ſo wee ſhould bee readye houres ſende home agayne hath lent v lo thus ſee iob alleageth naturall reaſon bringeth another ſecond reaſon vve receyue good lord hand receiue wee euill alſo ſithe wee bee ſo greatly bound vnto god vile vnthankfulneſſe wee find heart ſuffer thing ſake furthermore marke thys reaſon well wee muſt firſt compare god hys creature ſecondly muſt compare benefytes god gyueth v benefites receyue men vvhen god cōmeth rank pray al honor authoritie giuen creature droppe reſpect whiche due vnto god hee hath deſerued let v marke well hundreth thouſande tymes pacient ſuffer affliction bee aduerſitie came vnto v behalfe men whome bounde yet purpoſe vvhy ſo bicauſe maieſtie god ſurmounteth creature ſuch wiſe cannot diſcharge ſelues towards becommeth v although duetie towards men impoſsible accompliſh whiche owe vnto god aboue muſt marke gratious gift dealeth v continually hys owne hand let v count well ſure whē haue counted vttermoſt muſt confeſſe dauid nother number meaſure wherefore god goodneſſe bottomleſſe pit inſomuch muſt needes rauiſhed oft long time wee muſe vppon proofe thereof man conſider god hath ſhewed ſelfe father euen birth yea birthe pray muſt confounded reach hundreth part seeyng caſe ſo ſtandeth god grace innumerable meanes comprehended receyue wee aduerſities ſendeth v although afflicted much yet ſhould god benefites farre ſurmount affliction ſuffer hys hande let v marke well ſayde reaſon iobs ende ſo euer god ſhall afflict v may beare thinges paciently aſſuring ſelues good reaſon ſhould receyue aduerſitie hys hande ſith haue receyued ſo many benefytes reſt thys ſentence ſhall reſerued till morrowe bycauſe nowe ſet length let v pray thys good god may pleaſe haue alwayes regard infirmity whenſoeuer hee ſhall afflict v foraſmuch good reaſon ſhould inured vnto pacience ſo long thys worlde although wee bee forced paſſe many thornes diuers hartgreeues vexation mind yet neuertheleſſe good god ſo arme v ſtrength wee may quayle foraſmuche life corruptible ruinous caban holde v vp feebleneſſe euen vnto ende vntill ſuche time hee haue ridde v quite cleane infirmity fleſhe therewithall wee alſo hauing recourſe vntoo fatherly goodneſſe whych vſeth towards v may ſuccoured neceſsities doubting hee bring v ſaluation hath promiſed v aſſuring ſelues perſiſt obeyſance ſhall neuer diſappoynted wee ſticke vntoo promiſes neuer fayle haue hande ſtretched ouer v ſuccour v may pleaſe graunt thys grace v alſo al people nation earth c tenth sermon third vpon ſecond chapter sermon conteyneth reſt expoſition tenth verſe afore afterward verſes following 11 three iobs friendes hauing heard aduerſities happened vnto vvitte eliphas themanite baldad suhite zophar maamathite came place vvhere dvvelt agreed come haue compaſsiō comfort hym 12 vvhen lift vp eye farre knevv lifted vp theyr voyce vvept rent clothes caſt duſt vpon head tovvarde heauen 13 ſatedovvneby vpon ground ſpace ſeuen dayes ſeuen nightes ſuche vviſeas none ſpake one vvorde ſavve greefe vvas greatly encreaſed yeſterday declared effect iob meant thys ſentence vve haue receyued good lordes hande receyue wee euill alſo ſerueth ſhewe men toto vnthankfull acknowledge themſelues ſo greatly bounde vnto god number benefites whych haue receyued hand ought refuſe maner affliction liſteth exerciſe vnderſtande otherwiſe though theſe wordes vvee receyue good lordes hande iob hoped yet time come god would ſame towardes agayne felt heretofore ſo ſeemeth iob meant comfort wife himſelfe ſaying thys myſerie ſhall continue euer although god puniſh v meaneth continue vttermoſt end haue pitie vpon thoſe ſo diſtreſſed naturall meaning haue ſet downe already▪ witte iob calling remembrance good hee receyued god hande helde ſelfe ſo beholden vnto hym thought ſelfe bounde abide aduerſities paciently heerevpon wee may gather good profitable doctrine wit oft long aduerſities oppreſſe v wee muſt acknowledge god hath ſhewed hym ſelfe ſo good father v ſo many ſortes becommeth v thinke ſtraunge hee chaſtize v time prouoked moued grudge againſt ſame heerewithall certayne iob coulde haue bene comforted except hee applyed god former benefites tyme come wee conſider onely howe god hath bene good v tyme paſt wee ſhall haue purpoſe could paciente hath bene ſayde alreadye vve muſt bee well aſſured goodneſſe loue god muſt truſte continually hys grace doubting hee wil proceede loue v ſtill notwithſtanding deale roughly v iob calleth minde benefites hee receyued heeretofore god hande ſuche wiſe hee maketh concluſion namely god changed nother purpoſe nature ceaſſed continue good righteous notwithſtanding afflicted hym vvhen haue conſideration v wee ſee wherewith aſſuage ſorowes true aduerſities go againſte nature ſharpe harde v beare lyke medicine bitter troubleſome therefore muſt ſomewhat ſweetned may eaſlyer receyued god alſo gyueth v wherewith ſeaſon oure ſorrowes intente wee ſhoulde bee ouer ſorrowfull heere wee ſee principall poynt namely although god ſeeme bent againſte v yet conſidering haue found ſo good hee hathe made v feele loue ſo many ſorts wee ſhoulde doubt continue ſame euen end thys cauſe ſayde theſe thynges iob offended lippes wee muſte vnderſtande heere iob hypocrite glorifye god hys mouth yet mind heart contrarye vvhere fore ſayde hee ſinned hys lippes ſhewe hee wonderfull ſtay hym ſelfe true ſometymes although wee conceyue euill imagination yet wee holde ſo euill wordes eſcape v howe man tempted bee offended god many imagination runne head ſo muche hee woulde fayne lifte vp ſelfe willingly agaynſt god yea euen conceyueth blaſphemies heerevppon bridleth rebuketh ſelfe thus wretched creature meaneſt thou vvee ſee middeſt temptatiōs god gyueth v grace reſiſt ſo wee come extremitie blaſpheme hym openlye bee blame worthy meane whyle conceyuing ſuche thoughtes ought condemne ſelues ſo god appeareth well holye ghoſte hathe wroughte v wee haue conſented ſuche temptation liking man may well take thys ſentence thys ſenſe namely iob offended hys lippes ſay hee came extremitie although hee ſore prouoked euill yet hee reſiſted ſo euill ouercame hee maynteyned hys battell ſtedfaſtly notwithſtanding wee haue conſidered thing throughly doubte iob ſet heere v man rightly perfecte pacience better comprehending heere let v marke sainct iames ſayth hee hath ſinned tongue perfect aboue men ſo vve ſee foraſmuch men bee ouerſwifte ſpeake inſomuch thing ſpoken conceyue hee able holde ſelfe ſo word ſlippeth good aduiſemente well ſet ſheweth ſelfe bee indued wyth ſingular grace thus wee ſee wee haue note heere concerning iob namely howe hee ſo farre ſhewing ſturdineſſe againſte god euen hys wordes ſo well ordered whereas men light ſpeech vnable rule tung iob humbleth hym ſelfe god heereby wee bee taughte call vppon god graunt v grace wee may neuer caſt foorthe woordes maye tende diſhonoure hys holy name wee knowe tongue ought bee dedicated chiefly honoure god true wee oughte applye member therevntoo like hee hathe created ſo good reaſon ſhoulde bee imployed hys glorye hee wyll haue tongue ſounde ſuche wyſe mouthes may bee inſtrumentes glorifye hym ſo wee applye contrarye muche peruerte order nature foraſmuch wee bee gyuen vice haue ſayde nothing difficulte withholde ſelues therefore wee haue ſo muche neede call vppon god hee maye gouerne v ſuche ſorte wee maye vtter one woorde ſhall bee hys honoure furthermore wee nowe conceiue ſome euill imagination poſsible wee muſte needes haue manye wicked thoughtes conſidering great frayltie howe satan eggeth v let v aſſure ſelues already faultie god muſt aske forgyueneſſe yet therewithall fight valiantly ſtill thruſt thoſe thing vnder foote according ſayd yeſterday iob rebuked hys wyfe alſo diſcouered hir folly therefore becommeth v take good heede enter diſputation pleading againſt god rather learne bridle yea rebuke ſelues iuſtely thus ſee muſt bee ſharpe condemne ſuche vice v heerein wee ſee beaſtlyneſſe hathe reigned reigneth yet ſtill thys daye among papiſtes ſay ſinagoges man fall doubt whether god whether god rightuous hee conceyue horrible outrageous blaſphemies head ſinne ſo conſente vtterly man tempted ſtrip neighboure clothes murther blaſpheme giue ſelfe whorehunting ſo hee feele affection within carrie away ſay ſinne muſt ſuche folke needes worſe brute beaſtes ſee one reſolution whiche common ouer among papiſtes well worthy ſuch reſolutions foraſmuche nothing hypocriſie meanes wherof make ſo light ſin nothing al making veniall ſinne man hath offended god deadly whych man haue committed horribleſt ſinne world needeth one ſprinkling holywater diſcharged towards god parte haue ſayde let v thinke prouoked wicked doubtingneſſe wee bee condemned alreadye god let v preuent iudgement bee owne iudges yeelde ſelues guiltie yet meane whyle let v doubt god hath mercie v wyll hold v vp infirmity conditionally grace holy ſpirit ſhake ſuche thinges agree put wicked imagination practize ſhall haue conceyued mindes thus ſee ought deale thys behalfe conſequently ſayde three iobs freendes hauing hearde myſeries happened vntoo hym tooke aduyce viſit ende haue compaſsion hym comfort good likelyhood firſte bluſh god meant releeue ſeruant iob ſente men vntoo pretended haue pitie vppon miſeries skilfull wiſe comforte hym well ſhall ſee diſcourſes anon howe exquiſite perſones ſo man might ſuppoſe god would hencefoorth ſtretch hande vnto iob deliuer miſeries hee ſente ſee viſitation freendes increace miſerie plundge euen bottome endleſſe waues vvhereby admoniſhed time hope drawen affliction muſt thinke ſtraunge though matter fall haue conceyued wee ſee iob diſappointed hope whē ſawe friendes became diuells torment bene tormented afore yet notwithſtanding minde ſo neyther came mocke iob brought malicious purpoſe wicked intente right hartie good loue towardes ſayd meaning haue compaſsion ſay take themſelues ſome part miſerie ſo farre poſsible beare ſuch greefe bene ioyned knit togither perſone lo end came yet notwithſtanding wee ſee iob affliction grieuouſly increaſed let v take warning ſuch example although well minded towards neighbour deſirous comfort miſeries yet god muſt guyde v el ſayd good intent nothyng auayle v therefore wee ſee neighbor daunger neceſsitie truely ought beſeech god gyue v grace haue compaſsion ſuccoure yet wherefore bycauſe haue ſpirit wiſedome ſo much go cleane awke yet beare ſelues hande beſt world ſhall dryue poore man deſpayre felt much hys miſerie vve ſee manye zelous perſons whych earneſt deſirous ſhewe themſelues charitable towards thoſe whome able helpe handſomneſſe good faſhion dealing▪ vvhen come poore creature already afflicted bring hym new torment whereof commeth euen want diſcretion skill therfore god muſt fayne worke thys cace haue ſayd wee ſuccoure one another neceſsitie god ſhall haue giuen v affection let v pray hym gyue v alſo meane right vſe hand may gyue good profitable may haue skill handle folke according ſhal conuenient agreable nature ſo perſon plunged exceſſe anguiſh comfort bring may bee ſo well applyed hys vſe hee may feele ſome reliefe vvee muſt pray god giue v thys vertue founde v afterward god haue giuen v wiſdome hee muſt alſo put louing kindneſſe v wee bee rigorous towardes thoſe whoſe well may haue cauſe paſt hope rather inclined pitifull affection ſay mildly minded hope well well according ſayde charitie hopeth thing thus ye ſee haue marke furthermore wee compare theſe men ſelues find certaintie god hath neede gouerne v cace vvhy ſo theſe none common ordinarie ſort men haue declared already dullardes bee greate perſonages well aduiſed poynts accordingly ſhewe themſelues bee yet neuertheleſſe ſee proceede ſuche wiſe let iob myght haue bene dinged downe vnto hell cauſe god ment ſhewe v nother wiſedome diſcretion mind man rule meaſure hym excepte hee hymſelfe gyue let v bee ſure vnleſſe wee haue wee ſhall bee able comfort ſuche afflicted iobs friendes whiche ſo excellent men ſo ouerſhoote themſelues much likelyhoode wee ſhall miſſe god ſupply want giue wherewith behaue ſelues meete v thus wee ſee haue remember moreouer whereas ſayd tooke counſell haue compaſsion comfort theſe two woordes ſhewed v dutie ſuch ſee friendes neighbour indure aduerſitie two thing requiſite comforting alſo ſuccouring may imploy ſelues vttermoſt ſuccour ſuch haue need help yet ſhall great matter wee haue hart bee ioyne ſelues though wee felt griefes owne perſones vvee may giue goodes poore yet haue loue nothing sainct paule ſpeaking ſo ſheweth wee maye well doo many fayre thinges whiche notwithſtanding ſhall bee leaſings vanitie except wee haue louingneſſe guide ſhall ſee ſome aduenture themſelues valiantly man ſtande neede helpe yet haue feeling compaſsion griefe lo ſayde iobs friend come comfort drawe miſerie haue compaſsion deede man v whiche firſt formoſt deſyreth comfort men ſhoulde haue compaſsion example man indure aduerſitie happeneth others come ſerue bee opinion doo good haue care bee touched compaſsion miſerie doubling grief true ſhal receyue good done vnto regardeth compariſon compaſsion ſo much whereas men ſuccour giue ayde yet perceiue himſelf thoſe poore folk haue feeling miſerie member make account ſuccour man giue without minde diſcharge ſelues duetie towardes thoſe aduerſitie let v beginne poynt witte pitie miſeries feele ſome part neere true tryall loue herewithall true wee muſte alſo ſhewe compaſsion doings bee ſorie ynough ſee neighbour aduerſitie yet therewithall fare blockes ſo man get ſuccour bee ſo diſmayde muſt followe faſhion ſet downe namely pitifull tender harted ſuch ſort ſee man endure aduerſitie wee alwayes haue handes libertie ſuccour abilitie god hath giuen v muſte wee haue mindes ſo ouerſet ſorrowe oure heartes ſhoulde diſmayde wittes vtterly amazed rather pitifulneſſe muſte extende yet quicken v vp ſeeke howe wee may ſalue ſores ſee neighbour meant ſecond place ſayd iobs friend beeing come mourne purpoſed haue comforted ſpeede ſo comming onely weepe ſay feele ſome part thy miſerie alſo comfort bin poſsible thus ſee minde came fayled middes theyr iourney vvhen went firſt hande errand good minde hilde meane requiſite needfull whiche come ſhoulde haue ſame compaſsion towardes iob ſtill ſhould haue ſought ſuch meanes comfort beene moſt agreeable ſhould haue ſhot alwayes marke ſo▪ yea contrarywiſe became men amazed howe doubtleſſe found thing offended perſone iob howbeit foraſmuch ſawe ſuche extremeneſſe affliction ſeemed god would haue handled ſo ſharply except hee bene caſtaway ſo tooke ſuche conceyte reaſon exceſsiue miſeries ſawe iob▪ loſt courage comfort wee ſee ſayde pſalme happie man hath conſideration trouble dauid paſſed way well iob hee indured great aduerſities ſuche ſorte hee lyke hee bin forſaken god according haue ſayde heretofore man might ſay beholde bee ſeene fondneſſe glorie truſting god warrant himſelfe woulde ſuccour wee ſee plaine contrarie aſmuche therefore dauid condemned men vnder colour god perſecuted exerciſed pacience ſundriewiſe hee ſayeth right happie man hath conſideration afflicted hereby meaneth wee ſee man anguiſh hard aduerſities god requyreth aboue thing ſhould firſt daſhe take ſuche conceyte ſay damned god ſheweth full well hee purpoſeth cut hope behold paſt recouerie vve muſt bee ſo rigorous wee muſt haue wit ſay verie well let v wayt god aduerſities common well good men bad light vppon good men without cauſe vvhen god ſcourgeth although wee perceyue cauſe wherefore doth yet becōmeth v conſider god rightuous vvee ſee affliction common god choſen people ſuch hee holdeth child and▪ alſo caſtawayes thoſe go damnation foraſmuche v iudge except god hath ſhewed v ende affliction ſhall come vnto▪ becommeth v holde verdit ſuſpence man ſhould ſay man afflicted well let v acknowledge hande god begin ſay ala haue well deſerued much wretched creature looke thou haue offended thy god ſo many wayes may puniſhe thee hundred thouſand folde thou ſeeſt indure ſo much let v aduiſe ſelues conclude thus well ſee poore man handled roughly true hee lead naughtie life hee ſuffereth rightfully yet knowe god lo wiſedome dauid exhorteth v vnto namely wee ſhoulde wayte ſee whether god deliuer thoſe whome hee perſecuteth owne hande albeit rightfully done alſo let v learne fenced agaynſt ſtumblingblocks may come way wee bee troubled thing exceede imagination letted duetie continually harte fayle v middes iourney truely leſſon hard put vre ſo muche payne ought put ſelues vnto god giue v grace bring thing ſpake beginning namely haue deſire zeale comfort neighbour wee muſt deſire god furniſh v meanes intent whē commeth put vre become vnprofitable like blockes woode yet notwithſtanding muſt thought ouer ſtraunge iobs friend ſo aſtonied conſidering plight wherein founde vtterly diſfigured ſo coulde know firſt ſight text ſayeth vndoubtedly ſuch affection rooted hart ſawe ſo miſerable yet coulde ceaſe ſhewe loued ſtill howbeit knewe vtterly aſtoniſhed conſequently ſayd lyfted vp voyce fell weeping theſe teares came counterfeytneſſe good affection howbeeit foraſmuch abaſhed reaſon great miſeries iob indured wee ſee bee ſo troubled daſhed countenaunce bee able doo duetie meant haue ſome loue vtter ſignes requyred loue muſt well ruled end may well ſerue one anothers turne god commaundeth touching ſayd rent theyr clothes caſt dust vppon theyr heades cast themſelues vpon grounde ſeuen dayes ſeuen nightes without ſpeaking woorde therein ſee ſayde compaſsion whereof haue ſpoken afore beſides ſee howe meening humble thēſelues iob make interceſsion godward haue pitie vpon men olde time caſt duſt vpon head token humilitie acknowledgement ſinnes firſt knewe eſtate ſay doth god puniſh v let v bethinke v whiche wee haue forgotten wit wee bee rottenneſſe thing nothing men proſperitie make themſelues drunken flaunt ſore ayre touched care aſſoone god ſmyteth ſtorme conſider neither whence come whither muſt returne alſo men olde tyme end bring remembrance vſed ſayd ceremonie thereby yeelding themſelues faultie god though beene wretched offender thing requyred offender handes ſhould acknowledge fault craue pardon yeeld themſelues guiltie god returne vnto true repentance iob good occaſion ſo friendes alſo could ſhew forth friendſhip done like bee bound take vpon v perſone neighbour aske god forgiueneſſe behalfe greateſt reliefe giue ſuch diſtreſſe pray god ſhake altogither wee cannot prayer ſuccour thoſe aduerſitie without hauing haue recited wit without keeping companie humble ſelues afore god without cōming mourne dauid proteſteth euen enimies ſaw running intoo deſtruction hee ſorie hart ſhead bitter teares ſighes dauid haue done thus enemy perſecuted ſhoulde doo knowe child god certainly ought follow dauid praying enemy without ſo chriſt auow v diſciples ouergreat leudneſſe wee haue ſuch pitie vpon thoſe perceyue ſome ſigne godlineſſe religion inſtructed al one doctrine v therefore come ſue pardon god hande becōmeth v ioyne caſe behold ſay ye haue marke ſayd iobs friendes rent garment caſt thēſelues againſt ground ſprinkled duſt vppon heades herewithall note although ſuch ceremony bee ſignes repentance yet wee muſt thinke men ſhal diſcharged clothing themſelues ſackcloth much weeping vſing ſuche maner faſhions may make ſeeme haue nothing lowlyneſſe aduerſitie rather muſt bethinke oure ſelues ſentence ioels rende hart garmentes whereby ioell meeneth purpoſe men haue great ſtore ceremony martyr themſelues much outwarde ſight worlde except harte broken maner rending breaking god requireth hart wee ſhoulde bee caſt downe humbled perceiue ſignes wrath ſpecially feele blowes hande alreadie ſhould paciēt aſſuring ſelues come ſinnes wee many beaten god roddes chawe theyr brydles lyke mule conceyue wote fierceneſſe bitterneſſe ſerue ſet rage agaynſt god notwithſtanding make countenaunce though well tamed contrarywiſe haue ſayd behoueth hart rent according exhortation made vntoo v pſalme laying hart open god ende ſhould know within let v follow ſayd ſaying prophet ioell ſhould rend garment harte rather therein true repentance ſhewe itſelfe impoſsible hart ſhould rightly rent withoute ſhewing foreſayde lowelineſſe experience confeſsing ſinnes intent giue glory vntoo god herein man may ſee mockerie thoſe thinke himſelues haue done muche haue graunted haue done amiſſe haue committed great offence agaynſt god haue caſt ſtumblingblocke intoo church yet peraduenture man grate vpon little would make vnderſtande fault would mkae ſay totoo much woulde ſeeme vnto god ouerſharpe rigorous agaynſt wiſe muſt thinke god receyueth v repentant perſons except bring ſacrifize ſpoken one fiftith pſalme maner sacrifize wee haue heartes mindes ſo diſtreſſed wee ſo aſhamed committing ſinnes conſcience hath remorſe accuſeth v knowe become vntill haue found fauour god thus much concerning point repentance conſiſteth ceremony hath hir ſeate hart man howbeit ſhe muſt ſhew hir ſelf ſignes haue minde well diſpozed wee muſt ſo appeere men may onely haue woorde mouth ſay haue offended alſo harte muſte ſpeake tung ſayde iobs friendes ſate ſeuen dayes ſeuen nightes ment departed place whyle abode ſpace ſeuen dayes lamenting caſting themſelues vppon earth ſpecially yeelded good record loue towards abandoning pleaſures commodity bee ſorowing meant comfort lo ſumme therwithall ſayd ſpake one worde wherein wee ſee whiche haue touched heretofore namely ſore troubled ſaw god hande ſo rigorous vpon iob came ſette purpoſe comfort iob dumb vvhat cauſe haue forgotten reaſons might ſerue comfort withall welſettled remembrance wee ſhall ſee hereafter vvherefore hilde peace bycauſe preuented imagination howe vvee tooke man haue beene ſeruant god peraduenture god puniſhed wee would haue thought yet bene ſome order comfort ſee god hath forſaken hath ſet markes vpon ſhewe reprobate perſone hope therefore ſee meane comfort thus ſee cauſe aſtoniſhment ought haue eye god promiſes whereby hee witneſſeth vnto v ſeemeth vntoo v loſt paſt hope recouerie v hee able ſende remedie ſtill howbeit ſo hereby admoniſhed touched afore pray vnto god holde v moued ſuch compaſs aduerſities eyther ſelues neighbor conclude muſt paſt al hope recouerie diuell deſires nothing cauſe v make ſuch concluſion put intoo heades god hath caſt v suppoſeſt thou hee ſay god wil euer receyue thee mercie ſeeing thou haſt offended ſo many wayes giue place ſuch temptation beholde howe bee bereft god grace hys promiſes therefore let v ſo much earneſtly pray god ſtrengthen v ſuch wiſe may beate backe ſuch aſſaultes satan whenſoeuer wee afflicted owne perſones happen ſee neighbour ſuffer aduerſitie wee may vtterly diſmayed rather take courage make concluſion wel true theſe affliction great yet muſt wee ſtil truſt god hope wil turne aduerſitie welfare according maketh thing doth worlde ſerue welfare faythfull haue conſideration v wee ſhall neuer deſtitute cōfort trouble neuer bee barred god helpe ſo flee vnto ſuccour let v fal downe preſence good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may alwayes ready indure chaſticementes hee ſhall ſende v abide without ouertroubled mind therwithall may neuer aſhamed condemne ſinnes iniquity craue pardon ſpecially yeelding ſelues guiltie bee deede may ceaſſe call vpon aſſure ſelues mercie ſhal neuer denied v come true repentance deſiring nothing ſubiect good walke feare obedience time life may pleaſe graunt grace onely vnto v alſo c eleuenth sermon first vpon third chapter 1 iob opened mouth curſſed day 2 iob anſvvered ſayd 3 let day periſhe vvherein vvas borne night vvherein vvoorde vvas brought man childe vvas conceyued 4 let day bee ouercaſt darkeneſſe let god require aboue let haue brightneſſe giue light 5 let darkeneſſe thicke ſhadovvs ouervvhelme let bee ouercouered vvith clovvdes let heate day burne vp 9 poſſeſſed bee night vvith darkeneſſe let bee reckened among dayes yeare come number monethes 7 deſolate bee night let haue gladneſſe 8 let vvoont curſe dayes curſe alſo fall mourning 9 let starres darkened let haue hope light neyther let eye liddes morning tvvilight ſee 10 bycauſe ſhette doores wombe bare mee hyde theſe trouble mine eies wee muſte conſider intent holy ghoſt ende wee may applie whole doctrine oure vſe hitherto haue ſeene iobs pacience ſubmitted himſelfe wholy vnto god yea hath ceaſſed bliſſe notwithſtanding deemed miſerable among men ſeemeth turneth topſiteruie angrie god marke thing wel throughly combate wherein ſee one ſide man infirmitie ſheweth ſelfe ſide hath yet ſtill ſome ſtrength reſiſt temptatiions iob mamering meanes whereof whereas heretofore nothing conſtancie ſtoutneſſe mixture ſo frailtie fleſh maketh ſo far ouerſeene murmureth agaynſt god howbeit intent fall god neuertheleſſe woordes ſcape whiche euill proceede faultie minde cannot iuſtified thus ye ſee firſt point haue conſider wit ſtate iob namely ſheweth himſelfe ſo ſtedfaſt afore incountered ſuch battell doth well ſhewe frayle man able beare temptation faine would ſubmit himſelfe vnto god ſo peaceable minde requiſite bene wont wee haue profitable warning firſt wee ſee men able giuen aboue therefore let v learne brag owne ſtrength ſee part men abuſe themſelues bearing themſelues hand owne free wil able moue mountaines worke wonder muſt deceyued ſuch imagination muſt aſſure ſelues long god vpholdeth v may well ſtande loozen hande v ſhall caſt downe thing whereof man boaſt muſte altogyther depende aboue reſort alwayes thither bee well ſtrengthened herewithall wee ſee ſodaine chaunge happened iob ſeemeth hath newe occaſion bee ſo pacience curſſe day byrth conſidering howe hee dooth ſeuen dayes hee ſhewed himſelfe ſo pacient hee ſeemeth bee become quyte another man hee ſtrength vaniſheth away turning hande god continue ayding v wee ſee wherefore man lykened ſhadowe onely bycauſe lyfe ſo frayle flightfull alſo bycauſe wee vnconſtant ſo holde v wee bee fickle mynded looking ſometymes ſo ſtately ſhould ſeeme wee courage lyon becomming faint harted woman ſo neyther reaſon ſtomacke v ſo farre wee hauing valiantneſſe encounter againſt temptation wee cannot abide ſo muche heare man ſhoulde rebuke v lette v marke well ſuddenneſſe chaunge befalleth vntoo menne wee may looke better aboute v wee haue called vppon god morning lette v doo like day long bee ſhort let v thinke vppon god continually without turning oure ſelues aſyde anye maner wyſe thus wee ſee howe wee muſte alwayes bee carefull thus wee ſee howe wee muſt alwayes continue prayer ſupplication nowe let v come whiche ſette downe text howe iob curſed day byrth haue bene would excuſe iob altogither though beene caried away aduerſitie howbeeit without blaſpheming god ſome imagine hee hathe forgotten pacientneſſe whiche hee heretoofore hee altogither inraged ſo hee hath mynde glorifie god caryed awaye owne paſsions ſpeaketh man wittes heretofore hee blamed wife folly nowe hee ſheweth himſelfe double foole curſsing day wherein hee borne certayne iob come ſuche extremitie alwayes purpoſe obey god wee ſhall ſee neuertheleſſe mixture wit fighting hee fayleth wounded ceaſſeth receyue blowes ſtaggereth ſteppeth awrie let v marke mixture wit iob hath ſo ſounde perfection hee afore yet notwithſtanding although aduerſitie pinched ſo likely hee ſhoulde haue faynted middes way hee hilde courſe ſtill ſtill purpoſe obey god howbeeit meane ſayeth paule accompliſhed good deſired paule place treateth himſelfe confeſſeth although whole deſire giue himſelfe vnto god yet notwithſtanding came ſo paſſe hindered owne nature ouerweake paule acknowledged ſo muche himſelfe let v thinke ſtraunge like ſhould happen iob ſo ſhould deſirous frame himſelfe good god yet affection ſhould ſo perfect poynts muſt faine halte ſtoope herein ſee happened father iacob ſuch time god meant cauſe v vnderſtande whenſoeuer faithfull incounter againſt temptation ſhall bee without carying awaye ſome curſte blowes ſhall leaue theyr markes behinde vve ſee howe iacob wreſtled angell god wherefore hee god enemie bycauſe lorde tryeth thoſe mindeth alſo proue owne child haue ſeene firſt chapter therfore ſayd patriarke iacob ſtroue wreſtled angell vvhereby appeareth god ment exerciſe alſo iacob diſpoſed himſelfe beare bruntes hee ſhoulde put vnto inſomuch god inhonored giuing name iſraell whiche much ſay mightie towardes god meane went hee away victorie withoute touch breſt thigh cruſſhed ſuche ſort halted lame lyfe vpper hand yet hee faine humbled behold faythful withſtand temptation namely ſome poynt may chaunce ſtoope yea euen ſuch wiſe god ſhall humble dayes life may haue occaſion know infirmity till grone againe yet get vpper hand incountering god ſuffer vtterly oppreſſed muſte god child comfort themſelues god ſendeth afflictiōs may well feele ſome ſuch inward heauineſſe mindes ſhall knowe way turne yea ſo farre ouerſhoote themſelues vſe wordes excuſed yet infirmitie ſtrength god ſhall ceaſſe dwell ſtill hold vp ſuch ſort ſhal feele themſelues haue alwayes ſome good affection although legges fayle yet hart ſhall holde owne ſtill prouerbe ſayeth thus ye ſee haue marke ſentence may better vnderſtand wherein iob ouerſhot himſelf farre let v conſider maner lawfull men wearie lyfe haue bene many heathen men knowing miſeries earthly lyfe haue ſayd day byrth ought time myrth ioy rather ſorrow ſo much man commeth beginneth weeping beholde creature full vncleanneſſe vyle miſerable poſsible bee imagined moreouer wee marke thing well bottomleſſe gulfe miſeries whereunto wee ſubiect wee haue eye preſent ſtate condition lyfe wee ſhall haue cauſe ſay wee ought lament child borne oguth rather reioyce men die foraſmuche bee deliuered many euilles heathen men ſpake maner howbeit vnderſtanding able reache ſo farre god leadeth v woorde ſought preſent lyfe continue howbeit altogither eate drinke alſo honour purchaſe themſelues eſtimation finiſh euery man owne courſe herewithall haue holy scripture telleth v god hath put v bylowe hath printed owne image v therefore wee ought conſider nobleneſſe woorthineſſe hee hath giuen v aboue creature god hath faſhioned v owne image lykeneſſe whereby hee meeneth haue glorie ſhine v pray wee whereof reioyce ſelues wherefore magnifie furthermore beſides eating drinking worlde wee haue alſo recorde god father purpoſe earth bringeth foorth hir foyzon euen nouriſh v withall happeneth fortune god hath ſo ordeyned wherefore bycauſe hee woulde ſhewe himſelfe father towardes v vvee ſee helpes whiche maynteyne v heere bylowe auouchmentes proufes fatherly loue god ought wee make account ſuch benefite yea wee make ſo great account deſerueth yet god exerciſe v bylowe hope heauenly lyfe giueth v ſome taſte calleth v bee ſerued honoured v ende ſhoulde knowe wee hath interteyned v bee houſholde familie thing bee well conſidered haue good cauſe magnifie grace beſtoweth vpon v ſendeth v worlde inioye preſent life yet neuertheleſſe true alſo wee haue cauſe ſigh ſob foraſmuche bottomleſſe pit miſeries ſo long wee muſt marke whence ſame proceedeth paynim knewe ſtate menne miſerable wee muſte conſider wherefore god hath made v ſubiect ſo many inconueniences namely bycauſe sinne wee muſt haue recourſe firſte creation man conſider god niggarde goodes hath poured bountifully fountayne liberalitie hath hee ſhewed himſelfe liberall towardes mankinde perſone adam wee bereft thoſe bliſsings requiſite god ſhould cut benefites giuen v forſomuch father adam owne vnthankfulneſſe turned away vntoo wickedneſſe ſithe wee ſay miſeryes preſent lyfe fruites ſinnes wee haue occaſion ſighe bee ſo miſerable ſtate ſo harde troubleſome giuen ſo much naughtineſſe ſo great rebelliouſneſſe agaynſt god whereas image ought ſhyne foorth v ſeemeth wee haue conſpyred doo ſpyte cauſe sainct paule lamenteth wee ſee true ſorrow chriſtians ought make hauing cold heate induring diſeaſes calamity ſee themſelues priſon bondage ſinne vvretch ſayeth sainct paule ſayeth hee ſo bycauſe hee impacient hee lyfteth vp himſelfe agaynſte god hee inſtrument holy ghoſt ſheweth v preſent life wee haue cauſe ſighe grone without ceaſsing ſo wee bee ſhutte vp deadly pryſon ſubiecte ſo many wicked luſtes wee meanes atteyne dedicate ſelues vnto god reaſon great number corruption ceaſſe prouoke v vnto euill thus wee ſee howe wee maye lament cace example saynct paule giueth v rule thereof wee ſee howe iob curſed daye byrthe wherein hee bee excuſed neyther bee ſayde hee ouerſhotte himſelfe ſo behoueth v ioyne bothe togyther witte god created v hee alſo prynted hys owne image v dyd v honour bee excellenteſt hys creature whiche reſpecte wee haue cauſe bliſſe name continually althoughe life bee ſo full miſeries nothing bee yet cace ſtandeth ſo wee ſufficientlye value ineſtimable benefite god hath beſtowed vppon v giuing v preſent lyfe bycauſe mainteyning v therein hee maketh v feele experience hee hathe care v wyll meanes forſake v howſoeuer worlde go seeing wee haue haue wee whereof reioyce euen middeſt aduerſityes faythfull man whiche ſpeaketh good aduiſement neuer curſſe daye byrth miſerie ſoeuer indure iob therefore behaueth hym ſelfe vnthankefully godwarde curſing ſo day byrth cannot bee ſayde hee deſerued blame paſsing boundes furthermore let v marke child god maye alſo bliſſe byrthday meane conſidering want bewayle themſelues wyth sainct paule ſimplie hauing eye benefyte whiche god gaue hee ſent worlde true heathen men abuſed ſolemnized theyr byrthday exceede many folly ſuperfluous pompes original welſpring ſolemnizing byrthdayes holye father knewe good
