reaſon yeelde god thankes therefore hilde daye ſolemne feaſt ende prouoke themſelues prayſe god yea verily wee haue paſſed ſome yeares life althoughe wee ought call god benefites remembraunce inceſſauntly yet requiſite day entraunce worlde ſhould bee kepte euerlaſting memoriall ſo wee might ſay ſee well yeare paſt god hathe brought mee hitherto haue ended many wayes therefore meete ſhoulde nowe aske hym forgiueneſſe aboue thing hee hathe ſhewed mee great fauour hee hath maynteyned mee alwayes hope ſaluation hath giuen hath deliuered many daungers therefore becommeth mee call ſame remembraunce nowe enter intoo another yeare good prepare ſelfe ſeruing god euill aduentures haue paſſed ſhewe howe great neede haue ſuccour without ſhall bee vndoone hundred thouſande time thus ſee howe holye father woont ſolemnize theyr byrthdayes howe good profitable exerciſe heathen men ſay haue abuſed wee ſee thys day howe call themſelues chriſtians doe play flat mockholyday god ſolemnize theyr byrthdayes make reckening prayer thankeſgyuing acknowledging theyr ſinnes god benefites pampering themſelues beaſtly manner haue ſayde behoueth v alwayes bliſſe god vpon byrthdayes muche god hath ſet v heere worlde bee child hee hath put v foorth ox dogges reaſonable creature beare image muche wee bee baptyzed name oure lorde ieſus chryſt beſydes oure creation god hathe alſo moreouer prynted hys marke vppon v aduauntage intent wee ſhoulde bee deere friendes bee receyued intoo hys churche therein wee haue cauſe bliſſe god double ſo curſſe day theyr byrthe chafing miſeryes affliction endure ſhewe well bee vnthankefull owne affliction doo muche ouermaſter euen ſo ſtoode cace iob therefore wee haue cauſe pray vntoo god without ceaſsing hee vouchſafe holde v backe nowe hee ſuffer v let ſlippe ſome wicked wordes bee ſo ſtedfaſt requiſite yet notwithſtanding thoughe wee bee ſhaken wee may fall recouer ſelues agayne learne gather oure wittes better aboute v brydle oure ſelues wee ſee hathe beene frayltie v wee maye condemne faulte intent returne agayne intoo right waye thus yee ſee wee haue marke heere ſayde curſed bee night wherein worde brought beholde manchilde conceyued ſhoulde ſeeme iob meant ſpyte god ſo dooing thoughe wee haue cauſe haue earſt ſayde bliſſe god creating v hys owne image likeneſſe yet caſe ſuche menne preferred woman mankinde know god hathe ordeyned man heade giuen dignitie preheminence ouer woman heere wee ſee alſo sainct paule ſayeth man muſte goe heade bare bicauſe hee glorie god woman glorie man true image god printed alyke bothe yet woman inferiour man wee muſte goe thoſe degree whiche god hathe ſette order nature reaſon god ſhoulde bee gloryfied bothe male female howebeeit hee muſte chiefly bee gloryfied byrthe manchilde yet cleane contrarywiſe iob ſayeth curſſed bee night wherein reported manchilde borne hee ſo become haue thoughte well theſe thinges according god diſpoſed dayes yes iob turneth contrarie heere wee ſee whiche haue touched namely hee ſo wanzeth awaye owne paſsions hee forgetteth god graciouſneſſe whereof hee ſpoken afore ſayde well ſeeing haue receiued benefite god hande ſhoulde wee alſo receyue euill wee bee bounde bee ſubiect vntoo iob ſhoulde haue borne theſe thinges well minde howbeeit muche excellenter matter haue manchilde borne haue womanchilde hee ſayeth curſed bee night wherein hee conceyued haue ſayde afore teache v praye god arme v giue v ſtrength power withſtande temptation conſidering hee patterne pacience ſo carried away therefore time wee bee incombred exceſſe ſo oure fleſhe prouoketh v ſuche wiſe wee haue ſo quiet mynde obey god bee deſyred let cauſe v bee heart ſithe wee ſee ſame thing hath befalne vntoo iob behoueth v humble oure ſelues acknowledging owne frayltie meane whyle good courage vntill god haue giuen v full victorie furthermore wee haue marke alſo ſuche haue child oughte ſo reioyce hauing menchildren reiect theyr daughter wee ſee ſome vaineglorious fooles doo thinke god dothe greate wrong hee ſende menchildren purpoſe ende continue theyr houſes purchaſe eſtimation come credite lo manner men woulde prolong theyr owne lyfe euer yet meane whyle god giue daughter profite knowe therefore woulde haue god conſent theyr fooliſhe fancy alſo god dooth oftentymes puniſhe preſumptuouſneſſe hee giueth menchildren thoſe deſirous ſcratch eye ende seagulfes ſwallowe vppe ſubſtaunce father opinion theyr child ſhall increaſe houſe haue malechildren yet moſt commonly occaſion bring houſe confuſion ſo ſhall bee poynted wyth finger cauſe thereof men applye themſelues god vvhen men deſire haue child deſire good ſo bee well ruled muſt come poynt lorde thou giue mee iſſue let bee ende thy name may bee honoured gone thou doo mee worſhip bee father let mee ſo bring vppe child thou ſhalt giue mee maye bee rightly thine ſo maye learne ſerue thee thou guide according thy good beholde ſay howe father mother muſte content themſelues vvhen god ſendeth one childe whereas woulde haue three foure god ſendeth daughter whereas woulde haue ſonne let ſay euen ſo lord thou knoweſt meete v wee muſt frame ſelues thereafter behold ſay wherein bliſsing god ſheweth ſelf foraſmuch men inordinate deſires meete god ſhould ſcorne folly way taught alſo deſpiſe one another whereas god hath honoured men giuing dignitie beeing heade mankinde appoynted woman bee inferiour degree men muſte bee proude truely wee heare howe sainct paule ſayth mankynde come man wit adam howe dooth hee continue meanes woman men coulde ſeparate themſelues woman maynteyne little worlde themſelues alone ſhoulde haue good cauſe make boaſt nowe man conſider himſelfe hee ſooner ſay father hee muſt ſay alſo mother ſeeing mankinde continued meanes woman becommeth v thinke wee bee bounde one v another furthermore purpoſe woman created verily ſhee ſhoulde bee helpe man behoueth hir alſo bee ſubiect yet ſhee mannes companion scripture termeth hir ſayde among thinges god created anye helper coulde bee meete adam ſo bycauſe hee nature like vntoo beaſtes excellent creation nowe woman bee mennes companion cauſe diſdeyne men ſhoulde trample vnder theyr feete ſhake holde ſcorne muſt bee knitte togither ſayd mutuall bond ſaying well god created v faſhioned v hee mainteyneth v menne woman done ende wee ſhoulde liue togither one common accorde knowing bonde copartnerſhippe whiche god hathe conſecrated inuiolable betwixt v thus wee ſee wee haue remember wee may behaue ſelues vprightly nowe let v come whiche rehearſed heere ſayde iob wyſhed daye byrthe ouerwhelmed darkeneſſe brunt vppe wyth beate daye ſtormes tempectes ſtryken oute courſe yeare mighte haue ſtarres might come intoo kalender bee vnder gouernment moone ſeemeth heere woulde peruert whole order nature hereby wee ſee howe oure paſsions boyle wythin v true men coulde mourne without exceſſe affliction condemned vvhy ſo lorde ieſus chriſt affectionleſſe yea wee ſee hee endured greefe hee felt hee ſighed ſadde yet vnſpotted lambe god inſomuche nothing coulde blamed hee heauineſſe saue onely haue ſayde alreadie ſorrowing moderated conuenient wicked ſinfull ſelfe paſsions wicked bycauſe bee wrapped ſome ſturdineſſe agaynſt god ſome dyſtruſt ſome outrage fleſh god ſend v good euill v glad ſpecially wee cannot yeeld thankes muſt haue hart libertie feele good lucke hee hathe ſente v menne alwayes ſo full vanitie neuer make themſelues merry without offending god example god ſende ryches goeth wote vaynglorye medled cannot tell howe leaſtwyſe call vppon god ſuche feruentneſſe woont doo become verye lazie giue ſelues ouer whiche haue hande bee ſhort faſt men purpoſe make themſelues merrie bee ſad euermore bee ſome exceſſe hardlye holde themſelues offending god bicauſe haue ſuche ſtaye themſelues requiſite let themſelues runne randon ſpecially aduerſitie bee great menne ſhall verie hardly ſcape forgette themſelues bee caried awaye according befalleth heere vntoo iob hee ſayeth hee woulde fayne byrthdaye quite wyped yeare hee himſelfe diſpoſe dayes yeare hee ſhoulde deſyre chaunge god ordinaunce lorde ſheweth v modeſtie wee ought keepe making othes ſayth yee able make one heares youre heade whyte blacke blacke white howe ſweare heade iob paſſeth ſomewhat hee woulde plucke ſtarres skie hee would ſet whole worlde fyre burne vp earth woulde haue clowdes windes thing elſe mingle themſelues togither deſire hereby wee ſee men much pinched wyth aduerſitie ouerſhoote themſelues ſuche wyſe remayneth modeſtie thing elſe outrage sith wee ſee iob behoueth v ſtande vppon garde bee well aduiſed ſorrowing affliction bee ſuch ſort meane whyle god bliſſed hee doth wee prouoke diſpleaſnre euen vnaduiſedneſſe certaine iob ment diſpleaſe god willingly neyther intent dooe agaynſt god minde befell vnaduiſedneſſe paſſions blinde wee haue witte diſcerne wander without keeping eyther waye pathe ſo muche wee knowe affection bee ſo outrageous haue ſo much neede pray god rule v way wee compare iob wyth thoſe blaſpheme god open mouth pray howe woorthie ſuche men bee condemned iob hauing ſerued god tyme lyfe neuertheleſſe ſet vppon ſcaffolde ſpirite god ende men might perceyue theyr owne wretchedneſſe humble themſelues vnderſtande grace god fayleth forewardeneſſe caſt themſelues hell bee hilde backe seeing god exercyſe iob ſuche ſorte ſet oute gazing ſtocke make ſerue example learning vntoo others ſhall become thoſe blaſpheme god yea euen without cauſe ſome heart griefe happen ſo troubled man doo ſtyrre choler yee ſhall ſee teare god name peeces thinke ought ſerue excuſe ſay chafe mee man happen doo little diſpleaſure flie chaunce croſſe eye ieſus chriſte death bloud fleſhe euer hee hath ſhall bee torne peeces woulde ſay lorde ieſus chriſt taken man fleſh vppon bee made rayling ſtocke thoſe monſters handes woorthie liue vpon earth yet notwithſtanding take theyr excuſe ſaye ſuche man anger mee thou ſuppoſeſt thou bendeſt thy ſelfe agaynſt man yet notwithſtanding thou bendeſt thee agaynſt hym hathe grieued thee cace ſo god offended come aduaunce themſelues wiſe agaynſt god ſeeme monſters contrarie nature therefore lette v take heede wee ſo brydle affection god name bee blaſphemed v whereas ought bee prayſed bliſſed marke one ſpeciall poynt furthermore wee ſee blaſpheming god men haue certaine naturall rhetorike ſo cunning art lacke god hathe giuen v ſpeache intent wee ſhoulde confeſſe bee good righteous full equitie reſpectes caces ende oure talke indeuer ſhoulde bee ſpeake hym reuerence commeth poynt god ſhoulde bee honoured aboue thinges wee ſpeake ſo fayntlye ſcarcely man wring little woorde v ſhall bee well ſet men go blaſpheming yee ſhall ſee eloquent may bee deuyſed man maye ſeeme haue beene ſchoole learne fine rhetorike euen ſo iob ſet purpoſe haue ſayde afore withhilde himſelfe muche able hee fought agaynſt temptation yet notwithſtanding ſee howe owne nature caried awaye ſuche wyſe hee coulde holde hymſelfe kinde rhetorike whiche flowing wheretoo elſe ſerueth ſetting downe ſo manye faſhions ſpeache whiche hee heapeth vppe intoo little pyle ſo muche wee ſee ſuche vyce rooted menne haue wee doo vvee muſte pray god open oure mouth giue v grace woordes may tende honour moreouer reſtraine v ſuche ſorte wee maye take good heede wee ſpeake vntowardly aduenture occaſion giuen talke iudgementes good hee hath done v correction hee hathe ſent v ſuche lyke thing wee maye beare ſuche reuerence maieſtie woordes may bee well framed may bee anye reproche much leſſe outrage wee ſee happened vntoo iob yea wee muſt bee prouoked therevntoo hee ſayth let woont curſe dayes curſe daye byrth let rayſe vppe weeping lamentation ban night wherein conceyued seeing iob ſpeaketh ſo wee ſee yet better men haue neyther meaſure ſtay themſelues affection beginne boyle vp like potte firſt ſeething ouerpaſt hath caſt firſt skumme walloppes come ſo man cannot ſtoppe euen ſo fare affection ſo outrageous man cannot weeld firſt brunt contrarywiſe wee ſee taught v holye scripture namely dauid ment prayſe god became contented applie wittes indeuer dooing call men beare companie hee ſayeth alſo yee heauens thou earth ye tree yee hilles thou hayle thou snow thou rayne ye ſenſeleſſe creature prayſe ye lorde vvee ſee zeal ouſneſſe ought bee v wee mynde ſerue god good earneſt witte wee muſt deſyre onely menne woman alſo ſenceleſſe creature ſhoulde one common conſent applie themſelues prayſe god v ſo may bee nothing worlde neither aboue beneath ſhall bende ſelfe wholy glorifie god herewithall alſo let v pray god giue v grace bee able imploy ſelues thereaboutes ſtrengthen v againſt temptatiōs may chaunce onely agaynſte aſſaultes ſhall made vpon v enemy without alſo agaynſt affection within v let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgment offence beſeeching make v vnderſtād thē better open eye behold miſeries wherewith like drowned vtterly fordone may learne haue recourſe ſoueraine goodneſſe ſo may cōtinew thing ſhall haue begōne v making v taſte loue hee ſende v affliction eyther reaſon ſinnes tryall pacience may ſo vngracious grudge againſt rather bliſſe aſſuring ſelues hath iuſte cauſe chaſtyze v yet neuertheleſſe beſeeching gouerne v ſuche wyſe holy ſpirit wee may deſire nothing frame ſelues good ende hee may cauſe precious bloud ſonne ſhedde redemption bee auaylable v wee may bee ſettled therein vntill haue gathered v vp immortall glorie wherevnto calleth v may pleaſe graunt grace onely vnto v alſo people nation earth bringing poore ignorant ſoules knowledge c twelfth sermon ſecond vpon third chapter sermon contayneth yet ſtill expoſition tenth verſe verſe folowing 11 vvherefore died mother wombe wherefore yeelde vp ghoſte ſoone come hir wombe 12 vvherefore knee receyue wherefore haue ſucked teates 13 ſhoulde haue lyen ſtill taken reſt ſhoulde quyet reſt mee 14 vvith kinges counſellers earth buylde deſert place 15 vvith prince haue golde hoorde vp siluer houſe 16 ſhoulde vnty mely byrth hidden infant hath ſeene lyght 17 wicked reſt trouble haue traueled lie reſt 18 priſoners reſt togither man heareth voyce extortioner 19 greate ſmall equall ſeruant free maiſter haue declared heretofore bee heauy ſorowfull onely remembrance god benefites muſte cheere v leaſtwiſe aſſwage miſeries griefes ſo aduerſitie pinch bethinke great number benefites god hath done mee ſame muſt aſſwage ſorrow ſith cace ſtandeth ſo affliction ought make v forget knowledge whiche wee haue god benefites grace yet notwithſtanding commeth ſo paſſe vvhereof ſee example iob true mirrour pacience ſoeuer miſeries indured yet ought haue acknowledged greate good fortune hee ſent reaſonable creature world borne image god hee bene cheriſhed mainteyned vnto man age intent myght know god bee father beholde ſuch benefites ineſtimable yet iob ſo farre commending hee wiſheth hee neuer taſted vvee ſee howe ſore temptation trouble v ſteede taking ſome comforte aſſwagement ſorowes god benefites wee turne ſame corzie ſomuch could finde hart god neuer done v good wee neuer knowne iob vtterly minde bycauſe woordes eſcaped mouth without aduiſement force miſerie hee indured incouragement v conſent vnto wicked intentes wee muſte brydle ſelues ſuche wiſe ſuch fancy come heade wee may driue greate way v certaine greate ſinfull infirmitie worthy bee condemned wee ſee example ſhewed v two twentyth pſalme perſone dauid ſpecially perſone lorde ieſus chriſte dauid man deſtitute helpe whome god ſheweth himſelfe contrarie ſo muche hee ſeemeth vtterly ſhaken therefore hee cryeth god god haſte thou forſaken mee ſpoken perſone ieſus chriſt heade faithfull yet neuertheleſſe hath thus made mone hee addeth lorde thou diddeſt draw mee mother wombe thou diddeſt gather mee vp matrice thou haſte ſhewed thy ſelfe bee god coulde knowe thee call vpon thee dauid ſet geere purpoſe render thankes vnto god ſing vnto name middes ſorowes afterwarde ſtablyſheth himſelfe good hope time come doubting god regarded ſtyll cōpaſsion conſidering ſhewed himſelf ſo gracious pitifull towards alreadie ſee leſſon cōmon men diſtreſſed aduerſitie vttermoſte euen ſeemeth vayne thing loſt labour call vnto god yet behoueth v cōſider hath created v put v world imprinting owne image v giuing v many token knowe taketh v child ought make v lyfte vp mindes alofte yeelde worthy prayſe moreouer muſt ſerue v ſpurre make v truſt doubting ſhewe himſelfe ſame hereafter whome wee haue felte heretofore true better man vnborne vtterly lefte vp vnto miſerie ſo muche lorde ſayeth vnhappie whome offence come farre better ſuche man hee neuer bene borne yea cace ſtandeth vpon ſuffering calamity trouble wee muſte take ſo ſore harte forgette gracious goodneſſe hee ſhewed v pleaſed make v inioy lyghte worlde ſpecially condition ſhould child bicauſe hee hath printed image v therefore peece vnthankefulneſſe iob let v marke therwithall ſpake one conſented ſuche meaning hee ſo turmoyled eſcaped mouthe vnwares yet neuertheleſſe fully reſolued hart ſtill god done ſo muche good reaſon hee ought acknowledge hereby wee bee taught although god ſtrengthen v holy ſpirite ſo haue ſome pacience power withſtand aduerſities yet notwithſtāding ſome fraileneſſe mingled ſo much griefe ſhall carie v away ſome hideous tempeſt v ſo wee ſhall able rule ſelues poynts requiſite hereby warned walke feare ſtande continually vpon garde beſeeching god ſuccour releeue ſuche weakeneſſe hee knoweth v furthermore tyme wee ſo aſſaulted paſſe bondes make complaintes let vt praye god arme v wee may well atchieue ſuch combate howſoeuer worlde go let v practyze leſſon haue ſpoken ſet eye benefites god whiche wee haue receyued time paſte intent may ſo comforte v ſoro doo ouermate v oppreſſe v altogither wee may keepe ſtill ſome taſte god goodneſſe ende wee maye hope ſtyll mercye hande notwithſtanding wee haue lykelyhoode ſeemeth wee bee vtterly ſhutte thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne herewithall wee ſee menne fallen vnto wickedneſſe ho 〈…〉 alreadie muche haue ſayde doore mother wombe ſhutte vp borne worlde hee addeth knee receyue mee ſucke teate herein wee ſee iob conſidereth god benefytes owne profite albeit hee haue felte greate number rather reiecteth altogyther make ill beginning therefore wee muſte take good heede ſelues ſo ſoone lorde maketh v knowe good wee haue receyued hande muſte ſo touche v quycke wee may bee ſo churliſhe frowarde turne good euyll wee beginne forgette god gyftes turne contrarie wee ought certayne ſame inconuenience vyce wyll followe v vttermoſte wee ſee example iob vvhen god openeth moothers womb let v worlde hee gyueth v certayne woman take v vp according wee ſee verie needefull conſidering poore humane creature commeth foorthe greate neceſsitie thing bee done hee prepareth nouriſhmente whereby wee bee ſtrengthened hee turneth woman bloude milke wee myght ſucke ſuſtenance god doeth ſo prouyde v euen tyme wee haue neyther wytte reaſon daunger death able helpe ſelues aske helpe folkes handes god preuenteth ouergoeth v vvee ſee benefytes diuers kindes wee ſee iob put bundle angrye therefore lette v heereby take warning bee moued conſider god fatherly goodneſſe thanke ſame ſo often hee ſetteth foorthe anie benefytes wee haue receyued wee haue ſo begonne lette v go throughe ſayde frenche prouerbe loaues made horned ſetting amiſſe ouen menne haue ouerſhorte themſelues wote howe keepe meaſure nowe happened ſo vnto iob indewed ſo ſingular conſtancie ſhall become v leaues ſo needeth little blaſte winde ſhake v downe lette v vnderſtande neede wee haue flee vnto god hee may reache v mightie hande iob hath ſayde ſo addeth yet worſer whiche hee dead ſhoulde haue rest reaſon ſayeth hee death endeth thing ſo eyther riche poore seruaunt mayster thoſe haue troubled worlde holde themſelues quiet haue bene troubled alſo reste ſhoulde lye ſtill ſleepe ſhould haue care feeling miſerie ſeemeth firſte bluſhe iob ſpeaketh heere lyke heathen man hath hope lyfe come reſurrection howebeit ſame neuer cleane wyped harte ſometymes ſo greate ſo headdie paſsions v ſeede god choked lyght religiouſneſſe whiche wee ought haue dimmed conceytes thereof caſte vnder foote ſo beare ſway well woorth nothing neede bee declared length bee well vnderſtoode vvee ſee howe preſent affliction blinde v bee ſommer wee bee ouerwhote wee muſte take theyr familiar example ſeemeth one paynefulleſt trouble man indure ſpecially man bee ſo ouerloden hee faynt bee able holde hee woulde haue froſte ſhoulde clyue ſtones hee thinkes hee ſhoulde bee well refreſhed hee ſhoulde bee eaſe bee winter wee thinke heate bee greate v lo howe preſent paſſions cary v away befalleth men yet notwithſtanding ſome muche tender nyce ſuffer aduerſitie ſome bee therefore according eche man nature complexion thereafter doth hee torment himſelfe aduerſitie hee indureth thereafter dothe hee martyr himſelfe vttermoſte aſmuche wee ſee ſuche experience wee knowe men caryed away affection ſuche wiſe thinke vpon nothing thing grieueth tormenteth ſame thing bee ſeene heere iob hee ſo ouerpreſſed miſerie hee lo •• eth moſt vntoo whiche ſhoulde befall death thinketh nothing ſeconde lyfe ſaye hee thought nothing ſpake ſorte aduenture true hee knowledge beliefe printed harte lay couered fyre choked aſhes let v thinke ſtraunge euill ſinfull affection ſhoulde cauſe v ſo forgette thing knewe ſure afore wee ſee howe good zeale hath ſame propertie moyſes ſainct paule vvhen moyſes deſired god bee ſtriken booke lyfe ende people might bee ſaued wee ſee good holy minde euen ſuche one god allowed yet ſomewhat bee gaineſayde doth moyſes thinke god roote owne chozen god chaungeable purpoſe moyſes knewe well god chozen accepted bee one child howe dothe hee deſyre bee wyped booke lyfe muche ſaye hee neuer bene reckened number muſte obteyne euerlaſting lyfe dothe hee demaunde god waye hypocriſie nothing caryeth away owne zealouſneſſe ſo feruent hee paſſeth ſor nothing welfare people committed vnto matter hee hearde ſentence condemnation god woulde deſtroy child abraham offpriug god hath chozen himſelfe bee ſo rooted couenant god muſte alſo needes bee abolyſhed lorde rather lette bee razed thy booke ſay al people heere ſhall periſhe moyſes ſeazed ſo greate anguiſhe hee forgat himſelfe hee regarde himſelfe neyther conſidered thoſe whome god hath chozen muſte neceſsitie bee preſerued euen ende gone little thus wee ſee deſired wyped booke lyfe much bee ſayde sainct paule woulde wiſhe ſayeth hee bee curſed brethren ſake howe ſo sainct paule knew himſelfe bee member lorde ieſus chriſte ſure hee inſtrument purpoſely chozen glorifie woulde hee nowe repeale ſayde grace woulde hee breake courſe god determination hee knewe well vnchaungeable hee himſelfe declareth anone ſome contrarietie yea inconuenience came ſayde zeale whiche good holy draue inflamed ſuche ſorte hee reſpect owne welfare preſent tyme deſirous god ſhould fulfill promiſe ofſpring abraham intent name myght bee blaſphemed nowe wee ſee example good affection doo ſometimes ſteppe aſyde way god child make forget knowen certayne vnto thē ſith cace ſtādeth ſo muſt thinke ſtraunge though iob ſo hardly diſtreſſed hee forced ſpeake like harebrayne ſo maketh men alike equall bee deade ſhould ſeeme ſaying menne periſhe none lyfe dealing thus well cōceyued opinion minde ingraued harte hee ſpeaketh man raueth traunce griefe ſo blinded hee owne man become like boyling ſea wherein waues iuſtle one agaynſte another ſee wee fayre lookingglaſſe whereby wee may perceyue affection blinde bicauſe folowe reaſon knowe thing wee ought bee moſte certayne fully reſolued worlde ſhall become v wee knowe wee created better lyfe better v wee aſſes ox brute beaſtes inioy preſent lyfe feede take theyr reſt trauell without greate feeling men eate one morſell breade without care middes pleaſures haue number hartbytings owne beſydes wante anoyances men handes euery man himſelfe becommeth owne hangman therefore wee haue hope ſeconde lyfe ſhall become v truely lordes ſame ſhoulde abyde printed harte menne according wee ſee although heathen men become brutiſhe yet notwithſtanding retayned ſtyll ſome knowledge ſeconde lyfe immortalitie ſoule thoſe knewe god hathe lefte ſome marke whereby make vnexcuſable yea euen toombes haue made burie deadefolkes euen recorde reſurrection heere wee ſee iob wiſte nothing vvhat ſhall wee ſaye wee haue ſayde alreadie witte wee gyue heade affection put eye elſe ſeele vp ſo cloſe wee ſee neuerawhit ſpeake without aduyſed vnderſtanding ſtaye talke beholde wherevpon wee ought muze ſide lette v marke grace gyuen iob hee vtterly conſent ſo raunging talke bene blaſpheming god onely lette ſlippe ſuche woordes randon man asked ſayeſt thou difference betweene good men badde dothe death make finall ende thinges thou ſpeakeſt heere lyke infidell neuer knewe god god religion god teacheth v death better lyfe euerlaſting heritage hee hath prepared thoſe thoſe whome hee hath chozen reprobate ſeeyng haue deſpyzed theyr lyfe ſhall knowe bee iudge iob bene poſed thus hee woulde haue confeſſed ſuche thing yea euen vnfaynedly yet hee ceaſſeth ouerſhoote himſelfe ſame thing alſo wee ſee matter conſiſteth knowing wee muſte perſeuer ſame knowledge withſtande temptation aſſayle v haue readde holy scripture wee haue haunted ſermons haue bene taught requiſite man ſaluation yet bee negligent bende oure minde bethinke v thing wee haue hearde afore one man beeing well furniſhed corſelet murryon ſwoorde target ſhoulde hang vp vpon ſpirget ſuffer armour ruſte ſwoorde ſticke faſte ſcabberd hee ſhould come haue neede hee may well ſay haue armour weapon ready ſhall boote looke vpon yee ſee furniture vnprofitable bycauſe hee hath ſuffered ruſte moreouer hee ſhall knowe howe handle eyther ſwoorde target neede euen ſo ſtandeth caſe v vvee may well haue knowne thing good conuenient ſaluation yet wee thinke ſelues bee handſome well appoynted men wee ſhall haue skill howe applie thing behoofe knowledge ſhall bee ruſtie ſo ſhall come remembrance wee haue neede might ſtande v beſte ſteade ſee wee good leſſon v ynough v haue knowen thing god ſheweth v profit wee muſte alſo exerciſe without ceaſsing remembrance muſte bee refreſhed intent wee may knowe true vſe holy scripture whiche ſpoken befell vnto iob notwithſtanding earneſtly minded worde god meene word written woorde god hath giuen aſpiracion ſay miſſed beſotted moſt neede ſhall become v muche weaker hee therefore lette v beſeeche good god time make v humble ſuffer owne infirmitie ouerrule v ſo wee haue ſuche power warde satan blowes requiſite yet notwithſtanding ſame may bee croſſed reckening booke bee called account thus wee ſee wee haue wee bee aſſoyled god hande muſte wee firſt condemne faultes wee perceyue ourſelues furthermore touching ſtate ſeconde lyfe scripture ſheweth v muche expedient bee knowen behalfe true men come ende race god draweth backe hence beneathe life likened courſe race therfore haue made ende race iourney death yet wee ceaſſe eyther bee payne elſe bee bliſſed ioye ſoules parted body lo wee haue beare minde touching paynes preſent lyfe care eating drinking mainteyning oure ſelues apparell keeping oure ſelues harme taking well meanes men meanes beaſtes ſhall vtterly ceaſſe yet meane ſaide childrē god gathered vp ioy true yet wee haue crowne promiſed v whiche prepared v whole body ieſus chriſt muſte bee made full perfect togyther heere wee ſee ſayde lyfe lyeth hidde chriſte vntill tyme c • mming yet faythfull reſting abraham boſome already ſo farre foorth parttakers ſayde ioy knowe god father truſte whiche haue vayne ſpecially wee muſte marke howe sainct paule ſayeth long wee bee ſhutte vp within mortall body wee walke hope without beholding ſight thing promiſed v thoſe thing hid v wee bee parted worlde wee ſee thing wee hoped thing earſt hid v ſhewed openly vnto v vve ſee howe faythfull departed worlde ioy god knowe foraſmuche bee chriſtes member periſhe yea knowe muche better greater power done preſent lyfe reprobate condemned caytifs wayte houre execution torment ſure alreadie cō demnation heere wee ſee ſayde diuelles locked vp darke priſons bounde chaynes vntill come ſayde finall confuſion whiche prepared agaynſte comming lorde ieſus chriſte thus wee ſee scripture dothe briefly ſhewe v concerning ſtate ſeconde lyfe wayting laſte daye ſpoken ſoberly vnto v bycauſe wee bee muche gyuen fonde curious queſtions wee ſee men loue better bee inquiſitiue done paradiſe knowe whiche waye come thither beholde god ſelfe telleth v ſaying come mee hee ſheweth v wee may come thither wee paſſe woulde maruell ſee howe colde bee ſtandeth vpon poynt going vnto meanes hee hath giuen v yet meane whyle wee bee buzie demaunding done heere doone vvee deſirous knowe whiche god hath hidden v hee haue v knowe ought nowe onely parte heere wee ſee holye scripture vſeth ſuch ſoberneſſe bycauſe wee ſhoulde couet bee ouerſuttle theſe fonde queſtions bee contented knowe whiche profite yet neuertheleſſe ſtandeth v hande bee well reſolued ſayde article witte death reſte men true men yea euen wicked alſo haue ſayde ſhall bee diſcharged neceſsities preſent lyfe meane ſeaſon fayle bee tormented feeling god bee theyr iudge whoſe hande looke mercy knowe confuſion throughly ready ſhall bee plunged downe hell seeing ſay caſte repriued day feele vnquietneſſe whiche paſſeth paynes tormentes worlde behoueth v knowe intent wee lyue belowe wee may pray god guyde v holy ſpirite wee may couer vnlawfull thing wayting continually tyll hee accompliſhe promiſe gathering v togyther heauenly kingdome lo wee haue beare minde touching reſte although iobs talk ſquare haue ſaid alredy yet notwithſtanding wee may gather ſome good profitable leſſon howe ſo vvhen hee ſayeth kinges prince doo buylde vp deſert place hee ſheweth fooliſhe vaynegloriouſneſſe worldelings ſuche woulde make themſelues renoumed heere vvhen men deuiſe practyze conſulte buylding houſes palace wee knowe commonly exceſſe vvhē proceede according order nature ſay vell god wyll wee ſhoulde lodge heere belowe therevpon doe buylde themſelues houſes dwell according theyr article good lyne drawe meane magnifie themſelues worlde content themſelues wil printe euerlaſtingneſſe name palace caſtelles wyll haue bee ſeene farre vvho buylded ſuche place yonder prince thus yee ſee vayne gloriouſneſſe paſſeth beyonde order nature iob mente gyue inkling hee ſayde men lyue vpon earth prycked muche care ſuch wyſe take muche payne fayle heaue one another bee ſo prycked theyr owne luſtes wage battell agaynſte nature meaneth buylding deſertes make buyldinges incredible man commeth place hee maye take vp hys hande bliſſe ſaying howe poſible haue buylded place ſituation bee conuenient eaſie buylde vpon man ſee ſome fayre buylding vpon well ſhall thought ſtrange matter bee mockt ſome maner quippe man ſee place vnapprochable ſome take vpon ſay wyll make place eſtimation beholde deſert buylded vp beholde made new worlde suche maner men meene ſtomake agaynſte god purpoſe reforme worlde order god hath ſet wyll haue ſeene nothing ſhall let theyr purpoſe whereas god hath ſette barres ſay muſte go leape quite ouer lo vainegloriouſneſſe many men thing iob mente betoken heere alſo ſayde woordes farre ſquare howſoeuer caſe ſtandeth man maye yet gather ſome good leſſon moreouer hee addeth ſeruaunt ſet free mayster poore riche one ſhewe v men muſte glorie theyr preſent greateneſſe according ſainct paule ſpeaketh principality wherein hee ſpeaketh dauid dothe thus hee ſayeth pſalme haue ſayde ye god vvhich muche ſay prince ſuche authoritie god li •• etenants haue preheminence aboue reſte worlde thoughe god priuiledged yet yee mortall men ſhall dye men ſo aſſure ſelues thus wee ſee whiche aduaunced hyghe eſtate oughte dazle men eye rather acknowledge theyr owne frayle ſtate aſmuche worlde ſhape thereof paſſeth away theyr rich theyr credite honor ſhall come nought therefore let beſot ſelues let continually thinke vpon death let thoſe haue ſeruauntes ſubiectes vnder thinke thus themſelues muſte come account wee haue one heauen maiſter v ſainct paule ſayeth accepting perſons ſhall bee bondage maſterſhippe men alleage god true earthly policie alſo ſtate magiſtrates ordeyned god concerneth worlde worldely thing whiche ſhall take ende therefore muſte theſe thing bee tranſitorie alſo let v take heede wee holde ſelues lowlyneſſe modeſtie wee attempt thing whiche god hath giuen v libertie doe nowe let v returne matter wee beganne withall wit iobs talke ceaſſed bee outrageous exceſsiue without meaſure hee hadde conſented vnto beene horrible blaſphemie caſe ſo ſtandeth foraſmuche ſuche ſtrength ſelfe bee able maſter himſelfe hee attaynted many euill faultes men muſte needes feele encountering haue alwayes infirmity theyr fleſhe furthermore wee ſee heere howe iob ſpeaketh little babe whereas hee ſayeth vntimely byrthe muche hee ment tell v god putteth humane creature mother wombe hath ſoule contrarily wee knowe creature conceyued mother wombe god breatheth ſoule certayne hathe ſeede lyfe ſo iob ſheweth himſelfe bee well ynough ſettled wittes conſider god workes iudge rightly diſcerne betweene blacke whyte altogyther ſtrayght whereof commeth euen hardineſſe paſsions haue ſayde vvee ſee heere tempeſte ſtorme maketh iob bothe deafe blinde sometimes thundreth ayre ſo ſore troubled man heare thing oure wittes bee vtterly amazed therewithall bee ſtriken feare ſee flaſhes lyghtning heare thundercrackes ratling ſome ſore vehement hayle wee imagine wee ſhoulde bee fordoone wee ſhrinke ſelues inwarde ſuche wyſe dare put head euen ſo ſtoode cace iob vvherefore let v conſider theſe thing withall let v alſo beare minde doctrine haue touched already true muſte marke two thing wee haue two extremity whereof behoueth v take hede one ſorte thinke pacience man bee altogither peaceable ſorte opinion although a▪ man chafe agaynſte god reſiſt yet hee ceaſſeth bee pacient conditionally ende hee miſlyke faulte repent theſe men gyue themſelues brydle take leaue committe many ſinnes yea ſuppoſe themſelues bee pacient haue ſo ſtomaked agaynſte god meane bereeue themſelues god grace therefore wee muſt take heede theſe two extremity let v marke pacientneſſe ſubmitting ſelues god good bee without greefe ſtomake matter ſome time feele waues come ruſhing againſt v ſo wee ſhold ſenſeles perſons behalfe rather wee bee ſuche battels let v diſcourage ſelues matter lette v call vpon god therewithall feeling continually howe greately wee giltie let v pray ſtrengthen v power holie ſpirite wee may able withſtand ſuch aſſaultes whereby myght oppreſſed firſte blowe hee ſuſteyned v beholde ſay howe behoueth v deale ende god ſhall haue gyuen v power ſtrength withſtand temptation may encreaſe ſame v vntill come ende battels let v fall preſence good god acknowledgement fault beſeeching make v feele better haue done may ſory craue pardon walke ſuch aduiſedneſſe beeing ſhrowded vnder ſhadowe wing may fenced good inuincible defence againſt aduerſarie euer cā practyze againſt v aſmuch inuironed ſo many want world let v pray alſo bee ſtrengthned power frō aboue may faynt midſt iourney hold race hauing alwaies eye vpon glory promiſed v heauen purchaſed v death paſsion lord ieſus chriſt doubting wee ſhall fully perfectly enioy ſhall haue earſt taken poſſeſſion beneath hope pacience may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation worlde c thirtenth sermon third vpon third chapter▪ 20 vvhy gyueth hee lyght miſerie lyfe vnto haue ſorrow▪ full harte 21 vvhiche wayte death commeth whiche ſeeke buſily treaſures 22 woulde reioyce bee merye woulde bee gladde myght finde graue 23 vvhy giueth light man whoſe way hidden god hath ſhet vp 24 ſighing commeth take repaſte roaring lyke ouerflowing water 25 haue met thing ſtoode feare thing miſtruſted falne vpon mee 26 haue bene proſperitie haue bene quiet reſt yet notwithſtanding trouble come vpon mee iob complayneth though god men wrong put worlde exerciſe ſtore miſeries ſo maketh reckening god haue v liue ſhould mainteine v owne eaſe incomber v many trouble thus ſee briefly conteyned verily iobs intent pleade agaynſt god woulde go lawe yet meane whyle greefe hee ſuſteyned carryed ſo farfoorth theſe complayntes paſſed mouth nowe vvherefore hath god ſet v world end ſhould know father wee ſhoulde bliſſe bycauſe wee ſure hath care v contrariwiſe bee ſeene many men afflicted tormented many miſeries purpoſe doth god holde poynt ſeemeth hee would haue name bee blaſphemed vvhat whome hee handleth ſo rigorouſly ſee death eye rather haue betweene teeth fret chafe thus wee ſee occaſion murmuring agaynſt god ſeemeth himſelfe cauſe haue good profitable leſſon ſhould aſſure ſelues whē god ſcourgeth v yet hee ceaſſeth giue v ſome taſte goodneſſe ſuch wiſe euen middeſt affliction wee may ſtill prayſe reioyce yet notwithſtanding true reſtrayneth ioyes turneth thē bitterneſſe meane betwixte bleſsing god name blaſpheming whiche meane call vpon wee bee oppreſſed aduerſitie reſorte vnto deſiring receyue v vnto mercy men neuer keepe meane except god haue eye himſelfe ſcourgeth v therefore let v marke firſte whenſoeuer god ſendeth v trouble ſorowes hee ceaſſeth make v taſte goodneſſe therewithall aſſwage anguiſhe myghte holde harte diſtreſſe vvee haue ſhewed heretofore men eye god former benefites towardes thē yea though hee hath ſuſteyned childehoode hee brought mother wombe giuen lyfe ynough comfort euen bee ouerloden diſpayre make thinke may god puniſhe v iuſtly wee bee bounde beare paciently aduerſitie hee ſendeth nature teacheth v ſo foraſmuch hee beſtoweth ſo many benefites vpō v according iob hath ſhewed heeretofore vvee ſee howe onely one conſideration ought aſſwage ſorrowes according bee ſeene men put ſuger hony medicine ouer bitter wyll alay ſuche ſorte pacient may better take wheras otherwiſe would go neere choke yet matter namely god ſheweth v vſe chaſtyzementes whiche hee ſendeth v whiche hee meeneth deſtroy v ſo ofte hee ſcourgeth v profite welfare hee promiſeth v wee bee faythfull hee ſuffer v racked meaſure ſupporte v wee bee afflicted reaſon wee ſhoulde take pritche agaynſt god though founde nothing rigour hande wee bee ſo comforted affliction vnthankfulneſſe letted v myght reioyce ſay bliſſed name god although hee ſende v owne deſires thus muche firſte poynte nowe herewithall wee muſte marke alſo ſeconde article whiche haue touched already 〈◊〉 although wee haue nothing diſtreſſe although bee hilde vpon racke wee haue nothing comforte v yet muſte wee bee haſty take pritche agaynſt god wee muſte rather call vpon according ſayde let ſorrowfull pray sainct iames ſheweth v meane whiche wee oughte holde wee bee merrie ſayeth let v ſing maner worlde whiche ruffleth royetteth without acknowledging good come god rendring prayſe god gladneſſe wee bee ſorrowe heauineſſe let v pray vnto god beſeeching pitie v abate rigour thus wee ſee faythfull theyr wittes ende ſo go yet muſte ruſhe agaynſte god finde faulte neither muſte outrage thoſe whiche full pryde rebelliouſneſſe rather let v thinke thus lorde ſee ſelfe bee wretched creature knowe become woote doo except thou receyue mercy ſhewe thy ſelfe ſo pitifull towardes mee releeue miſerie longer beare thus wee ſee child god muſte beare aduerſities paciētly although god chaſtize roughly tyme ſeene although iob cō tinually minded ſame leſſon yet hee ſufficiently armed withſtand temptation ſayth vvhy god giue light ſuche troubled mindes remembred god iuſt cauſe keepe men middes many miſeries although ſtate bee wretched belowe yet god righteous ſtill albeit puniſhe v keepe v occupied many wayes yet becommeth v holde plea vnder colour holdeth v againſt ſhutte vp priſon wee bee lyfe neither muſt conceyue diſpleaſure iob ſufficiently conſider nowe ſuche perſone iob happened ouerſhoote himſelfe kicke agaynſte god want hauing ſayde regarde haue ſpoken muche muſte wee ſet mindes vpon ſayde two poyntes wit beare remembrance god neuer forſaketh v therefore wee may bee ouerſorowfull god ſendeth v aduerſities bycauſe wee bee ſure chaſtizing v ſuch ſorte therewithall hee releeueth greefe leaſtwiſe long ſelues owne vnthankfulneſſe ſecondly whē wee bee diſtreſſed wee god calleth allureth v friendly vnto yea ſay hee prouoketh v reſorte vnto prayer often wee bee vtterly ſtripped wee haue lo heere true remedy call vpon good god haue pitie vpon v ſuffer v bee ſo diſmayde ſay wote purpoſe go vnto god let v keepe ſelues ſuche incombrance perſwade ſelues wee ſhall alwayes ſure fare well wee call vpon god bee alwayes mercifull v euen middeſt affliction vvhen wee haue theſe two poynts well ſettled remembrāce ſhall ſay vvherefore god holdeth thoſe heere whiche ſorrowe minde wee ſee wherefore hee doeth greate reaſon god ſhoulde chaſtyze men greate ſinnes number infinite agayne wee looke vpon luſtes alſo bottomleſſe gulfe whiche hath neede bee mended god therefore muſte mortifie v furthermore wee conſider howe muche wee bee gyuen worlde wee ſhall finde affliction neede bee plucked god chaſtyzementes moreouer howe greate pryde preſumptuouſneſſe therefore muſte god needes humble v beſides howe colde wee craue helpe therefore hee muſte bee fayne inforce v finally ought fayth bee tryed made knowen ſee wee reaſons inowe god holdeth v heere haue v bee miſerable ſo nothing payne trouble torment anguiſhe whole lyfe ſufficient reaſon god ſhoulde marke heere ſpeciall poynte ſithe hee continually calleth v vnto maketh v free paſſage vnto wee haue ſuche remedie miſeries may wee holde ſelues well apayed vvee ſee howe wee oughte bee armed fenced agaynſte ſayde temptation whiche reygned ouermuche iob howebeit hee vtterly ouercome iob ſpeaketh heere ſuche deſire graue whiche willingly dyg ſome hidden treaſure longing dye cannot hee putteth ſelfe ſame ranke wee ſhall ſee ſequele wherin confirmeth owne infirmitie vice lawfull faythfull miſlyke owne lyfe wiſhe ſo death true wee may wiſhe death one reſpect whiche conſideration wee bee hilde ſuche bondage ſinne wee ſerue god ſo freely bee wiſhed bycauſe ouerfraught vice reſpect certaine may ſigh deſire god take v quickly worlde ſayde afore may bee hate lyfe wee bee weery bee hilde bycauſe wee bee handled ouer rigorouſly wee muſte beare lot paciently wayting god leyſure delyuer v wee ſee paule holdeth ſelfe ſame meaſure hee ſayeth romanes ala ſhall delyuer mee mortall body vnhappie yet therewithall hee ſayeth thankes bee god lorde ieſus chriſte lo heere howe sainct paule one ſyde calleth himſelfe vnhappie deſireth bee taken worlde ſyde contented reſte bycauſe god preſerueth hee knoweth god wyll neuer forſake howbeit hee bee ſubiecte many miſeries vvee ſee heere contentation wee may better vnderſtande whole lette v marke howe iob hath done amyſſe two poyntes witte hauing regarde hee ought haue deſyring death alſo keeping meaſure heere wee ſee two faultes groſſe vvhen ſay iob eye faſtned vpon marke hee oughte meane wyſhing death bycauſe hee ſawe himſelfe bee miſerable ſinner coulde attayne perfection whiche v oughte labour bycauſe hee weerie nipping greefes well whiche hee preſently indured perſone hee ſuſteyned gooddes ſo hee deſired death bycauſe ſeemed god preſſed ouerſore thus wee ſee firſte faulte ſpake wee apply ſame owne vſe wyll bee yet better vnderſtoode apparaunte man ſearche trye ſelfe throughly thinke thus himſelfe giuen ſuche vice fight agaynſte come purpoſe matter one vice alone haue two three torment mee surely yet giue ſelfe brydle neither wounde ſelfe feare vengeance god wyll holde ſelfe ſuche ſorte bee vtterly vanquiſhed ſee muſte bee muche earneſt ſeruing god fighting agaynſt worlde mine owne fleſhe verye requiſite ſhoulde bee hilde backe hindered myne owne luſtes ſaye man acknowledge himſelfe ſuche one hee hath well examined lyfe hee ſayeth therevpon yea god ſee ſelfe miſerable plyght ſhall bee deliuered needes muſte beare ſinne although reigne yet doth dwell mee elſe ſinne diuelles ſcepter whereby hee reigneth ouer v bondſlaue satan death god muſte tarie euermore weeryſome plight chriſtian man may well haue ſuche ſighes beſeech god ſet free ſuche bondage wherein hee ſeeth himſelfe bee matter concerne aduerſitie muſt regard nother colde heate pouertie ſickneſſe muſt haue eye onely ſinnes ſpecially god puniſheth v wiſe ſoeuer bee wee muſte mounte vp higher without reſting vpon bodily aduerſitie thinke thus ſelues behold fruites ſinnes foraſmuche wee haue done agaynſt god wyll good reaſon hee ſhoulde ſhewe himſelfe iudge towardes v vvhen wee haue thus acknowledged ſinnes ſame worketh remorſe v prouoketh v conceyue ſorow whereof paule ſpeaketh thus muche concerning firſte poynte ynough thinke afore ſayde wit wiſhe death ſuche wiſe haue earſt ſhewed houeth alſo keepe meaſure ſay wee muſte onely wiſh vpon good cauſe wee muſte alſo brydle deſire ſo bee ruled good pleaſure god bring paſſe outrage whiche ſhewed heere iob ſhall bee reſtreyned brydle haue alreadie touched poynt texte alleaged paule made moane wiſhed deliuered priſon death addeth thanke god hee ceaſſeth bee quyet euen midſt thoſe complaynts longing ſo hee ſeeth good reaſon god ſhoulde bee maſter gouerne v pleaſure wee ſhoulde paciently wayte ſuch ende hee liſteth gyue v paule perceyuing concludeth immediately although hee wretched ſinner yet notwithſtanding ſure god guyde ſuch wiſe ſaluation miſcarie paule thē eye thoſe two thing therefore hee ſayeth hee yeeldeth god thankes notwithſtanding hee bee miſerie euen ſo muſte wee ſo doyng ſhall onely readier indure miſeries world honour god hee may bee glorified bothe perſons humilitie alſo wee ſhall bee wylling ſuffer neyghboures sainct paule alſo ſheweth v owne example hee ſayeth philippian himſelfe ſhoulde bee farre better bee taken oute worlde youre ſakes ſayeth hee requiſite lyue bicauſe know haue yet neede laboure god imployeth mee aboute edifying fayth vnto ſubmit ſelfe afterwarde hee ſayeth although behoofe goe hence oute hande yet willing abyde ſtill lo howe sainct paule exhorteth men ſubmitte themſelues ſuche wyſe vnto god pleaſure whyle lyue thys worlde may onely beare theyr affliction pacientlie alſo bee readie ſuffer theyr neyghbours ſo theyr labour may profitable cōmon weale themſelues ſeruice churche god thus wee ſee wee haue marke leſſon yet vnderſtode aſmuche put vre god leaue v reſt yee ſhall ſee v ſo blinded vayne fond ioy wee bee ſo ouerſotted know neither death owne frailtie neither haue diſcretion god viſite v affliction needes bee aſked whether blaſpheme whether othes paſſe mouth ſtore miſliking murmuring▪ impaciencie ſhall bee full ſturdineſſe wind dore v many thinke vpon ſinnes grone vnder ſuch burden therewithall looke vnto ayde god giueth hee ſuffereth vtterly ouercome satan therevppon doo quiet themſelues take comfort hee preſerueth number ſmall yet written vaine generall haue conſider faithfull may wel ſigh grone life long till god haue taken world alwayes wiſhing ende ſaye death yet notwithſtanding muſt reſtreyne ſelues ſuch wiſe maye wholly ſubmitte themſelues god good pleaſure knowing made themſelues firſte ſay faithfull maye well ſighe folke wearie long pinning priſon theirfleſhe namely cauſe haue touched bicauſe ſerue god ſuch freedome requiſite drawe line amiſſe ſo woorke awrye oftentimes ſwarue aſide wee muſte ſyghe ſo farrefoorth lawfull v done ſo often enter conſyderation owne ouerwearineſſe matter ſtandeth vpon ſeruing god muſt ſpurre v deſire god take v worlde make v haue eye lyfe prepared v heauen ſhall fully ſhewed vpon v comming lorde ieſus chriſt heereby wee ſee howe onely graunted goddes child wiſhe deathe alſo ought wiſh ſhewe good proofe fayth except ſeeke go worlde according deed thing haſt labour toward marke mark aloft therfore muſt neuer leaue running till wee come wayes ende whyche god hathe ſette v wee muſte deſire may quickly neuertheleſſe lette v alwayes beare mynde cauſe haue ſpoken namely wee muſt bee prouoked wiſh death bycauſe ſubiect ſome ſickneſſe ſome pouertie ſome one thing ſome bycauſe fully reformed image god bycauſe wee haue many imperfection v marke well ſay cauſe muſte ſpurre prouoke v deſire death namely ende beeing ridde thys mortall bodye whyche like cabane full ſtinche noyſomneſſe maye bee fully reformed image god ſo hee may reigne v corruption nature bee vtterly done away furthermore lette v keepe v within compaſſe deſiring lyue dye goddes pleaſure ſo wee maye bee gyuen oure owne wyll ſo wee maye make ſacrifyze behalfe liuing maye bee ſelues god ſo wee may ſaye lorde knowe myne owne frailtie neuertheleſſe thy wyll holde world heere good reaſon ſhoulde tarrie heere whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe thee call hence make great accompt lyfe alwayes thy commaundemente diſpoſe thine owne pleaſure beholde ſaye howe wee ought deale thys caſe heerewithall lette v haue oure affection euermore quieted yea euen ſuche ſorte wee maye continuallye prayſe god name aſſuring ſelues life deathe hee alwayes ſhewe hymſelfe father sauioure towardes v iob hath ſpoken ſo addeth ſuch ſo diſtreſſed heartes would bee full gladde fayne myghte fynde theyr graue vvherein hee bewrayeth himſelfe ſpeake brutiſhe vnaduiſed affection hee keepeth neyther meaſure modeſtie hee confeſſeth wee come naught wee ſee howe hee falne howbeit wyth deadly fall halfe fall god rayſeth hym vp agayne afterwarde wee ſhall ſee yet neuertheleſſe caſe ſtandeth ſo wee muſt verily condemne thys infirmitie heere iob ſaye hee ſo diſmayed heauineſſe could taſte goddes goodneſſe thereby gather neuer ſo little comforte ſuſteine hymſelfe foraſmuche wee ſee thys befell vntoo hym ſo much muſt bee earneſt praying vntoo god ſorow maye ouermate v ſo wee ſhoulde bee vtterly ouerwhelmed therefore lette v alwayes ſo vnderpropped ſtayed vp wee may fight againſt ſorrowfulneſſe feele good v liue heere according goddes although wee haue great griefes trouble heere yet muſt wee ſtande fully reſolued vppon thys poynte good v continue ſtill worlde wherefore ende god may bee glorifyed v ende fayth may bee tryed ende wee ſhould call vppon profeſſe always father notwithſtanding ſcourge v end meanes thereof wee may bee prepared heauenly lyfe thys taſte ſaid fatherly goodneſſe muſt alwayes make v deſyrous go vntoo god ſuffer v gyue bridle anye one outrageous beaſtly affection ſee iob hath done heere waye hee ſheweth whence thys heauineſſe came vppon ſo wholly ſwallowed vp whence alſo proceedeth thoſe ſo diſmayde admit comforte aſſuage myſeries ſayeth man whoſe waye hidden god hath ſhut hee made hedge round man ſhould enter well worthy bee noted iob ſheweth wherein hee fayled namely yelding himſelfe inough god prouidence yet notwithſtanding heerewithall diſcouereth diſeaſe wherevnto v ſubiect witte wee deſirous knowe muſte befall v ſtate ſhall al would haue declared v ſo muche wee perplexitie ſo wee knowe ſhall become v inconuenience pincheth v ſee end wee poynte vtter deſpaire lo heere miſchiefe ouercommon ordinarie muſt marke well ende wee maye ſeeke remedie contrary part vvhat inclination men could well find heart leape vp cloudes knowe ſhall courſe whole life wee ſee determine themſelues salomon mocking ouerweening • n ſayeth determine vpon whole life whereas moue tip tung without god guide yet determine vppon mockerie able moue tippe toung yet preſume ſay behold ten yeeres hence according alſo sainct iames agreeth salomon ſcorning ſayd preſumptuouſneſſe men ſo long god letteth v alone eaſe euery man beleeueth hee liſteth himſelfe take ſelues bee petigoddes aſſoone god turneth hand beateth v roddes ye ſhall ſee v ſo amazed wote become thinke poſsible v euer ſcape miſeries looke one ſide ſee end bee ſo ſhet vp wee cannot take hold goodneſſe mightie power god ſuccoure v affection iob ſheweth v heere ouercommon diſeaſe wee fynd well ynough experience thing troubleth tormenteth v ſo much wee ſee ſelues ſhut vp know ende miſeries ſhall become v ſo much aſſayled ſides conclude ſelues neuer get away without vtter oppreſsion ouerthrowe haue ſayd diſeaſe let v reſort remedie diſeaſe cured wee muſt needes fall ſaid exceſsiue paſsion whereof mention made heere namely wee ſhall wiſh death men deſpaire ſhall haue aſſuagement miſeries deſire god ouerwhelme v hande conueniente remedie diſeaſe referre ſelues god prouidence hee may ſee brightly v ſith bee blynd darkneſſe god may guyde v knoweth good v leade v foorth enterpriſes behold alſo wherevnto holy ſcripture bringeth v backe ieremie ſayth lorde knowe way man owne power neither man walke direct owne ſteppes much ſay man taketh muche vppon purpoſeth diſpoſe owne lyfe let v vnderſtand god humble v much ſhutteth eye ſo wee ſee muſt become v know day wee haue tomorow god entertayneth v day lyke iourneymen men terme maner hyreling waged daye woteth ſhall ſet worke next morowe behold god haue v liue ende ſhould learne depend wholly vpon ſaying true lord life frayle yet thou knoweſt ſhall betide thou haſt forſeene lorde therefore put ſelfe thyne hande haue many care tormente trouble diſcharge mee intoo thy lappe foraſmuch ſure bee ſafe vnder thy protection cuſtodie holde ſelfe contented thus ſee behoueth v deale haue ſayd prouidence god thoroughly imprinted harte ſo depend wholly vpon although bee turmoyled many trouble world yet ſee good foundation make v ſtand ſteadie conſtant calling ſerue god according hys dayes life let v learne ſettle ſelues vpon ſayde prouidence god ſee thing ſo ſhuffled togither worlde wee know whych ſyde turne v may therefore ceaſſe apeaceable quiet aſſuring ſelues god ordereth guydeth thing ſuche wiſe nothing hinder welfare faithfull ſeeing hath takē protectiō thus ſee haue marke ſtraine ende iob addeth hee hath rest • e beauineſſe take repast yet notwithſtanding ſayeth haue behaued ſelfe heeretofore moſt men haue ſettled ſelfe proſperitie haue continually feared miſerie come vppn let v marke complaynt iobs one ſyde ſheweth miſerie extreme therewithall ſayeth hee cauſe god handleth ſo god threateneth menne hee ſayeth foraſmuche thou haſt made thy ſelfe drunken thyne owne pleaſures foraſmuch thou haſt bene blinded foraſmuch thou wart ſo altered didde thee good thou haſt knowen mee thou maiſt ſee wherefore intend puniſh thee god ſheweth preciſely cānot away fleſhly ſelfeloue men whē weene ſhall alwayes haue eaſe ſhall ſay peace ſafe behold ſodayn ſtorme ſhall ouerthrow forſaw afore hād vve ſee god puniſheth preſumption raſhneſſe men whyle bee proſperitie beleeue ſhall dwell euer meane ſeaſon conſider hande god thinke vpon owne frailtie god cannot abide eaſe wee muſt referre vnto god therewithall prepare ourſelues bee afflicted ſhall pleaſe hym ſuch maner hee knoweth expedient aſmuche god threateneth thoſe blynded manner pleaſures iob beholding himſelfe ſo ſore tormented afflicted amazed bycauſe hee tyme ſotted hymſelfe abundance alwayes fore miſtruſted miſchiefe nowe lyghted vppon borne hymſelfe hand hee ſhould thencefoorth continue eaſe proſperitie god ſet lyke thinke mortall lyfe god hathe aduaunced aboue others ſayeth continually thought afore hand miſeries myght happen vnto hapned hee ſo ouertaken although thing cannot diſcourſed length yet may gather thereby one word aſmuch iob alwayes put himſelfe readineſſe indure aduerſitie god ſhould ſend vnto ouertaken ſuch anguiſhe ſo greate ſtandeth v hande looke haue much worſe according deſerts god ſpare v hold v vp time let v therevppon conceyue vayne fond imagination thinke aduerſitie touch v wee thinke ſo god muſte wake v vp good earneſt ſhewe power authoritie hathe ouer v vvhat muſt muſt vigilant keepe good watch ſpecially god handleth v gently ſo wee ſuſteyne aduerſitie yet notwithſtanding wee muſt haue eye may betyde v example iob miſerie miſdoubted lighted vpon wee maye ſure ſharper ſighted hee foreſee farre inconueniences may hit vpon v alſo falne let v therefore ceaſſe reſort god ſee god hath ayded ſeruant end although hee ſeemed plunged gulfe hell yet notwithſtanding god reached hande therefore let v alſo hope like towards ſelues lette v pray thys good god may pleaſe open eye wee maye better knowe needefull v wee ſee howe many wantes miſeries wee bee ſubiecte worlde wee may learne ſigh grone ſpecially foraſmuch hild bondage ſinne ſo ſerue god full libertie wee may long kingdome heauen wee ſhall haue full perfection enioyemente grace whereof haue taſt worlde alſo ſhall ioyned heade ieſus chriſt reygne euerlaſting glory maye pleaſe graunt grace v alſo c fourtenth sermon first vpon fourth chapter sermon conteyneth ſtill expoſition two last verſes third chapter fourth chapter followeth 1 eliphas manite anſvvered ſayd 2 man aſſay talke ſhall greeue thee vvho holde himſelfe ſpeaking 3 behold thou haſt taught many thou haſt ſtrengthned vverie handes 4 thy vvordes thou haſte ſtayed vp vvere falling thou haſt ſtrengthned vveake trembling knee 5 novv euill come vppon thee thou art quiet novve hathe touched thee thou art aſtonyed 6 thy feare thy truſt thy hope vprightneſſe thy vvayes vpon iobs talke whych treated yeſterday ther remaineth vnderſtand proſperitie hope god continue time come let v reſt ſtill iob ſeemeth meene faithfull muſt alalways ſtand doubt muſt thinke thing hold one hand ſhall forthwith taken away herevpon wee note wee muſt imagin god promiſeth v vayne fonde preſumption men behight ſelues thing god leaueth dout therefore god puniſheth ſuch maner ouerwening imagin wee liſte write vpon ſhall ſo god haue v haue leaningſtock word whiche aſſured truthe lye therfore whenſoeuer men preſume vppon themſelues nothing vanitie leaſing wonder though diſappointed theyr purpoſe lord hath good reaſon mocke paſſe meaſure faſhiō ſo muſt hold generall rule truſt muſt ſettled wholly vpon god promiſes lette v conſider god promiſeth ſayeth haue thought vpon v day forget v tomorow ſhall helped hand al time life behold promiſe may well aſſure ſelues god always keepe v meanes thereof ſhall daunger falling intoo decay yet herewithal muſt make account ſubiect manie inconueniences lord ſayeth keepe v ſhut vp mew ſo ſhall ſee aduerſitie acquainted trouble continuall ioy felicitie hee promiſeth v ſuche matter onely aide ſuccour v neceſsities vvherfore behoueth v vnderſtand god exerciſe v manye aduerſities ſubiect cōmon affliction preſent life meane ſeaſon ought ſuffize v ſhall ayded ſhal bee vtterly forſaken seing caſe ſtādeth ſo perceiue well muſt ſleepe wee bee proſperitie though ſtate euerlaſting ſo nothing could change therfore preſuming ſo far ſtep beyond boundes ſo god telleth v may peraduenture ſuffer many aduerſities help v cōtinually meane ſhal fight yea aſſayled al ſides therfore thoſe paſſe boundes ſuch wiſe ſhal puniſhed ouerhardineſſe haue ſaid already word faithfull may euer doubt yet neuer ceaſſe bee quiet ſo conſider chaunges turmoylings world muſt needes afraid carefull euery v muſt prepare himſelf receyue blowes whē ſhal pleaſe god ſmite yet herewithall know falling wee light otherwiſe vpon feete bicauſe wee bee hild vp hande god bee vtterly oppreſſed bycauſe releeueth v vve ſee wee bee vexed ouergreat vnquietneſſe yet wee may bee ſore greeued oure heauineſſe withdrawe ſelues god make accompt calling vpon haue recourſe vnto ſhort great diuerſitie betweene careleſneſſe wherevnto inclined nature according diſpoſition • leſhe aſſuredneſſe wee haue reſting oure ſelues vpon god promiſes haue ſayd fleſhly preſumptuouſneſſe like certaine drunkenneſſe maketh v blockiſhe ſo wee haue regarde god hys helpe making oure reckening ſhall go well v though hee neuer looke v thinke vpon v reſt vpon god word call vpon hym looke v ſides conſider oure life thing nothyng ſtate wretched death manaceth v ſides bee hemmed infinite miſeries heerevpon wee pray vnto god make moane vnto hym yet neuertheleſſe pleaſe hym puniſhe v wee readye receyue ſtripes meekeneſſe loe howe wee ought deale yet faithfull man muſt enter intoo himſelfe acknowledge ſinnes conſider giueth continually newe occaſion god ſhoulde iuſtly puniſhe hym although wee bee promiſed god mainteyne v worlde though wee brooded vnder wing ſo ſhal bee peace without anye diſquietneſſe yet doo ſinnes cauſe hym chaſtize v ſhewe ſome roughneſſe towardes v god abyde ſuffer v runne ſo decay ſhould leaue v ſort randon without chaſtizemente woulde bee oure vtter vndoing earthlye father marre child cocker much certaine ſhoulde bee much marred god ſhoulde chaſtize v ſhewe ſome ſigne roughneſſe towardes v experience ſheweth abuſe goodneſſe reſpectes faithfull therefore acknowledging themſelues offende god without ceaſing muſt alſo beare minde hee hath roddes readineſſe beate ſinnes either day tomorrow chaunge proſperitie preſently enioy therevppon deale rigorouſly let v marke muſt ſleepe ſuch ſort god mainteineth v quietneſſe wee muſt alſo haue eye may betide v alwayes ready receyue affliction ſhall ſend v let v come reported heere witte eliphas themanite one iobs friendes came comfort entred talke againſt telleth effect ſeeth well feare god pureneſſe ſeemed haue outward appearance hypocriſie bicauſe hee delte ſo farre ſquare could paciently receyue correction god ſent anon entreth yet witte force muſt needes iob reprobate conſidering god handleth ſo roughly ſo good men neuer ſmitten ſuch extremitie lo heere firſt grounde eliphas taketh reaſon vppon againſt iob muſt thinke v whiche haue declared heeretofore iob hath good caſe hee handleth ill countercompanions hauean ill caſe handle wel according ſometimes man may ſet faire coloure vpon euill matter ſo ſtandeth v hand mark otherwiſe talke rehearſed v confuſed iob haue ſaid hath good caſe acknowledgeth god whiche ſcourgeth although account himſelfe worthie ſuche correction much ſinner yet notwithſtanding hee fully perſwaded god looketh ſending ſo great aduerſities vnto reſpecte ſinnes ſome ſecrete cauſe whereof priuie meane ſhutteth mouth ſayth win nothing pleading againſt god yet ceaſſeth vſe muche wandring talke cauſe ſayd handled good caſe amiſſe viſite take vntrue principle god doth alwayes deale men earthly life according deſertes thys ſaying vtterly falſe ſee plaine contrary ſcripture ſheweth v experience ſerueth v another proofe yet caſe ſo ſtandeth meane ſeaſon ſay ſo ceaſſe alleage good holy reaſons whereoutof wee alſo may gather good profitable doctrin howbeit better vnderſtanding whole let v call remembrance howe ſayde pſalme bleſſed man conſidereth aright hym ſmitten ſaye iudgeth diſcreetely hym afflicted maner wiſedome thinke god deliuer tyme aduerſitie thus wee ſee holy ghoſt requireth v wee bee raſhe iudges turne goddes woorkes vpſide downe vvhen wee ſee poore men beaten beare wee muſt vnderſtande god ſo mercifull ſuccoure ſayd hee meeneth deſtroy vtterly ſhort bee diſcreete iudgers chaſtizements correction god ſendeth vppon men wee muſte wayte ende muſt bee ouerhaſtie giue ſentence firſt daſh muſt ſtay ſelues marke pleaſeth god according ſayeth diſpleaſure ſhort mercie laſteth vnto life wee muſt encline ſelues wayte hitherſide witte hope well wayte good happie iſſue thus ſee wee haue marke iobs friendes remembred cauſe ouerſhot themſelues ſee iob ſmitten extremitie therevpon conclude god meant ſhew hym example reprobate perſon thoſe thinges happened vnto hee beene wicked vngracious perſon ſo conceyued ſcripture ſheweth v namely howe propertie god ſuccoure thoſe diſtreſſe ſcripture telleth v onely god aydeth afflicted alſo draweth thoſe graues ſeme bee alreadye deade although affliction bee great exceſsiue yet muſte wee ſtill hope god helpe whych doubtleſſe bee beyonde opinion man beyonde meanes conceyue thys text onely scripture ſpeaketh ſo doctrine ryfe ſayde righteous man ſhall bee ſhaken alſo hee ſhall fall ſeuen tymes day may fall many tymes yet ſhall god hande bee ready hold v vp ſo fallings ſhall bee deadly leaſtwyſe brooſe v ſo ſore god ſhall delyuer v beholde howe scripture ſpeaketh true bee dyuerſe promiſes whereby ſeemeth god maketh difference owne child reprobate deſpiſers hys woorde hee ſayeth hardhearted man ſhall bee tamed force ſtrypes lyke mule reſtye horſe god wyll ceaſſe beate vppon wyth greate ſtrokes whyche ſo rebellious ſturdye againſt contrariwiſe ſuch truſt ſhall hedged mercy ſay god al ſides bleſſe make proſper vvee ſee heere princely promiſe whyche ſeemeth exempt god child aduerſities yet behoueth v ſo expound theſe ſayd promiſes haue eye whych ſayde howe god knowen preſeruer ſeruaunts drawing graue god hedge v hys mercy make v cockney ſo aduerſitie ſhould touch v ſo ſhould needy ſo ſhould feele ſcarſitie ſo wee ſhould neuer haue greefe god mindeth vſe ſuche maner dealing conuenient v haue v paſſe fire water ſaye kynde myſeries ſo diſtreſſed wee wote become herevppon remedie neceſsitie ende wee may knowe whome wee bee beholding welfare thus ſee manner lord worketh alſo let v note iudge well behoueth beare thys point always mind witte onely god puniſheth ſuch worſt ſort alſo exerciſeth pacience hys faithfull one ſcourging handling farre roughly doth wicked ſhort let v alwayes haue eye iſſue haue ſayd let v maruell though wee ſee god help firſt day lo heere principle whych wee muſt lay v wee may know make owne profite whyche recited v touching wordes eliphas vſeth bee theſe man attempt talke man rayſe talke well one maye bee ſpoken bycauſe hebrue wordhath double ſignification foraſmuch hebrue word whych put heere talke ſpeech ſometimes taken alſo thing vnderſtande thus god tempt thee meete thou ſhouldeſt bee ſo farre pacience meete thou ſhouldeſt bee ſo ſore moued wee knowe scripture termeth temptation troubled god trieth v manner ſo euer bee meening ſhoulde bee ſuche meete thou ſhouldeſt repine againſt god thou ſeeſt hee tryeth tempteth thee ſaye thou ſeeſt hee mindeth proue thee thing bee throughly conſidered naturall meening man aſſay atumpt ſpeake ſo eliphas addeth immediatly bee withheld ſelfe ſpeaking hee ſhould ſaye thou art ſo farre ſquare agaynſt reaſon men muſt needes fynde fault thee myldeſt man worlde hee ſhoulde conſtrayned rebuke thee ſawe thy outrageouſneſſe thy behauing thy ſelfe heere lyke ſauge beaſte therefore thou muſte reſtrayned thou wouldeſt inforce meekeſt man aliue ſpeake lo heere playne meening effect eliphaſsis minde ſhewe iob hath walked aright cleere conſcience god lo heere firſt poynt afterward hee entreth thys generall argument whych haue touched witte righteous neuer oppreſſed wiſe wyth affliction alwayes token god vengeance therefore hee perceyued iob tormented thys wyſe hee deemed hym reprobate perſon thus yee ſee two poyntes nowe lette v come vnto firſt ſayth vnto thou bee • etofore baste taughte whole world thou baste ſtrengthned quiuering knee thou haſt refreſhed weerie handes thou baste amonded ſuche dyd amiſſe thou hast comforted ſuch tormented miſerie come vppon thy ſelfe ſee thou art quiet therefore conclude feare god whyche thou haſt ſame hope thou pretendeſt namely god ſhould alwayes haue bene fauorable vntoo thee bee ſhorte thou haſte ſerued god vpon vſurie thou diddeſt gyue ouer thy ſelfe vntoo good earneſt reſpect thou diddeſt hope would alwayes haue bene mercifull vntoo thee ſo long thou couldeſt well finde thine heart ſerue nowe thou ſeeleſt ſomewhat roughe thou renounceſt hys ſeruice vvhereby bee perceyued nothyng elſe hypocriſie thee thus wee ſee effecte whole ground diſcourſe eliphas maketh true wee marke ſelues wee eyther counſell men comfort rebuke euery man doo yea euen moſte ideotes ſayde common prouerbe eaſie health comſort ſuche diſeaſed wee ſhewe oure owne dooyngs thing whiche wee ſpeake vnto others ſelues wee ſpeake heart true proofe wee deale deceitfully vvee ſhall ſee diuers eloquent eloquent needeth whych babble ſo well purpoſe yee woulde wonder neuer want tongue bee prattle happen god doo fillip wyth finger ende wote comforte thing elſe meeneth vvhat bee done vvhen wee ſpeake neighbour let v ſhewe vnto thing whych ſpeake vnto mouth throughly grounded hart thus ſee ought proceede yet meant heereby wee ſhould ceaſſe comforte incourage neighbour reproue one another paſſe chaſtize ſuch amiſſe comfort ſuch heauineſſe reforme ſuch go aſtray ſhewe themſelues haue care neyther god hys ſeruice loue god right affection certayne muche vslyeth ſeeke men may doo lyke true chriſtian content himſelfe walke aright hee doo beſt drawe whole worlde ſame accorde therefore behoueth v put thing vre whiche sainct paule alſo ſheweth v teaching reforming one another ſayde wee muſt hart verely ſhall come triall may ſhew deede wee haue ſpoken teeth outwarde worde whiche iſſued oure mouthe throughly rooted hart ſee vſe god word namely teache ſhewe good alſo correct ſuche haue done amiſſe rebuke ſuche deale diſorderly ſtrengthen weake feeble thoſe ſmall courage therefore prophet eſay auoucheth belongeth charge prophet teacher church ſuche haue charge beare abroade worde god onely vtter whyche commaunded ſpeake wee may ſee heere god haue declared vnto v alſo haue cheerefulneſſe ſpurre pricke forwarde lazie giue courage weake lift vp falne bring backe ſtray right way thus ye ſee true vſe god worde namely way aſwell inſtruct men aright alſo ſhewe effectualneſſe goſpell according alſo sainct paule telleth v howe wee muſt applye holy ſcripture inſtruction ſayeth ſerueth onely knowe good diſcerne betweene good euill alſo exhorte reproue conuince v heereby wee muſt bee prouoked receyue god worde deſirouſly cheerefull louing affection ſomuch wee ſee howe belongeth welfare comprehended therein god onely bringeth v whyche behoofe knowe alſo foraſmuche ſeeth frailtie intendeth remedie haue hys word ſerue ſtrengthen v foraſmuch ſeeth wee brittle daunger fall hee ſetteth v vp agayne anone foraſmuch hee ſeeth v inclined hypocriſie ſoothe ſelues owne vice ſpurreth v ende wee may perceyue owne euills delight seeyng wee perceyue god hathe ſo well prouided thing whiche hee knoweth bee behooſefull hee haue hys worde ſerue v throughly behalfe ought wee bee inſlamed receyue ſame worde seeing wee perceyuc bee ſuche treaſure ought wee ſaye receyue cheerefull minde conſidering howe ſweeter hony ſayde nyneteenth pſalme alſo wee heare worde god ſtandeth v hande knowe wherefore would haue man doo nothing elſe ſay beholde wee haue marke vpon text man ſhould make colde expoſitions ſhoulde bee exhortation rebuking vice liuelyneſſe yea muche deface doctrine god man ſhoulde cut ſunder ſinewes body might haue ſtrength vvhat bee done vvhen wee come sermon man readeth alone ſelfe wee muſt vnderſtande god intent onely ſhewe v good ſhould ſay go way alſo rebuke ſinnes v may meſſenger pricke v forwarde learne humble ſelues euen ſo let v marke alſo howe ſluggiſh wee bee wee hye v vnto ſuche zele requiſite inſomuch hee fayne gyue v ſome ſtrokes ſpurre quicken v vp exhortation ſerue humble v make v ſubmit oure ſelues frankly hys thus ſee wee ought deale make worde god ſerue oure vſe wiſe ought put vre aboue cheefe charge muſt marke well bee quite diſcharged haue faithfully informed people good alſo muſte haue foreſayd liuelineſſe encouraging intent ſuche dull may ſomewhat quickned comforting ſuche diſtreſſe intent may finde reliefe god rebukyng ſuch delight owne vice ſpurre ſuche wiſe may abaſhed aſhamed ſelues like miniſters teacher muſt applye theſe thing men openly ſo muſte euery one v apply himſelfe following whiche apoſtle ſayth epiſtle hebrues alleaging ſaying prophet eſay ſayth wee muſt tarrye till others ſpeake v euery one v muſt bee ſcholemaſter ſelfe ſhould ſaye beholde vnto ſuch appoynted carrie abroade god worde name prophet eſay giueth commaundement comfort trembling knee ſtay vp handes ſuche faynt releeue ſuch oppreſſed pull backe intoo right pathe gone aſtray yet neuertheleſſe freends ſayth marke howe euery one alſo bounde ſuccour weake feeble cheriſhe weery heart comforte oppreſſed ſorrowe ſhort imploy ſelfe knoweth bee meete expedient welfare neyghbours finallye euery one v muſt duetie preacher towards ſelfe lo haue marke texte whereas recorde gyuen vnto iob inſtructed many heere ſhewed v firſt excellent vertue hym muſt alſo take inſtruction doo lyke witte drawe men v much v lyeth ſerue god one common conſent true men indewed ſo great giftes yet muſt euery man conſider hys owne meaſure imploy ſelfe according god hathe gyuen hym abilitie towardes hys neyghbors therefore wee muſt vnderſtande whatſoeuer god hath imprinted eche v common buylding vp hys churche wee muſt diſcharge ſelues according giftes euery v hath receyued ſo muſt profite others v muſt communicate togythers may go god one accorde euery man ſhewe openly hath deſire ſerue neighbour turne nowe let v come concluſion eliphas maketh foraſmuche ſayth hee thou art pacience aduerſitie come vppon thee muſt needes bee ſayde thou haſt beene hypocrite feare thou haſt hope looking god ſhould alwayes fauour thee verily iob beene ſuche one eliphas ſurmizeth bee hys ſaying beene true haue touched afore marke knowe hypocrite babble teach others ſhewe deede doctrine ſerueth owne turne haue fayre vtterance keepe nothing within ſerue owne turne neede let v learne bee euery man hys owne ſcholemaſter teacher minde profite neighbour doctrine let euery one v begin hym ſelfe whereas eliphas dothe iob wrong ſaying hee founde hym aſtoniſhed though beene nother witte reaſon hym wee perceyue thereby humble v therewith god may well ſuffer v bee ſo delte withall yet wee muſte alſo preſuppoſe whatſoeuer temptation happen god child ſhall neuer vtterly decay god ſuccoure ſuch wiſe ſhall haue wherewith ſtabliſhe ſtrengthen themſelues notwithſtanding nature bee ſo feeble weake euen ſtumble without ableneſſe riſe agayne god reached hys hande vntoo let v vnderſtande wee haue taught men wrought wonder reprouing ſturdie wilfull ſorte refourmyng thoſe went aſtray ſtrengthning ſuche faynthearted wee ſhall bee ſo muche blameable worthie bee condemned ſhewe owne dooings ſpeake hearte earneſtly greater ſhall damnation thoſe bee hauyng medled wyth teachyng others doe themſelues take profite doctrine ought well make v walke feare humbleneſſe therefore commeth cace inſtructing let v thinke thus true god haue mee ſerue neyghboures turnes ſo muſte bee myne owne iudge carye abroade woorde therfore muſt teach myne owne ſelfe otherwyſe frame life according whiche ſpeake vtter mouth wil greate horrible confuſion aboue men miniſters goſpel muſt well conſider ſee alſo sainct paule ſayeth blamed condemned himſelfe ende might firſt ranke condemning others ſhall come queſtion brief haue charge beare woorde god ſhall bee ſo muche blameworthie though haue faithefully taughte whiche god himſelfe hath ſhed vpon vs▪ gift holy ſpirit haue begonne ſhewe ſame owne perſons ſo muſt amende others lette v firſte amend ſelues muſt exhort others lette v firſt exhort ſelues lette v alwayes bee firſte leading daunce specially rebuke ſuch haue doone amiſſe let v practiſe whiche saincte paule ſayeth wit let v vſe ſofteneſſe reprouing haue doone amiſſe ſo looke vpon thy ſelfe ſayeth thou find thy ſelfe frayle muſt thou beare thy neighbour yet meanewhyle ſame muſte hinder liuely admoniſhments whiche god enioyneth v thus wee ſee haue gather may profit ſelues text wit ofte ſhal pleaſe god correct v maner ſo euer wee muſte ſhewe wee deſirous comfort men lyke trouble haue bin good faithfull teacher towardes ſelues concerning ſentence ſayde thy feare counterfea • neſſe • thy hope ſimplicitie thy wayes ſo lykewiſe eliphas meaneth ſhewe iob bene hypocrite hadde ſerued god deſire ſeeme ſeene certain ſerue god yea though feare wee ſhall haue agaynſt v ſlauiſh maner ſeruice god haue v bee hireling ſeruing haue v goe free courage ſo wholly giuen vnto may ſay lorde thyne reaſon euery one v ſhoulde dedicate himſelfe vnto thee labour glorifie thy name vve ſee howe ought haue free heart ſeruing god bee led ſlauiſhe conſtraynt true ſome textes rightly ſayde may well ſerue god conſidering ſhall diſappoynted labour according ſayde nintenth pſalme lyke place thys doth eaſily agree togither wit ſeruing god muſt led▪ free mynded affection yet neuertheleſſe muſt aſſure ourſelues god wil ſuffer laboure bee vnprofitable according alſo sainct paule ſpeaketh god ſayth rightuous promiſeth trauailing ſhall vayne ſo ſhoulde loſte labour bee ſo perſecuted holie scripture full doctrine ſpecially ſayde effecte ſuche truſte god ſhall loze rewarde touching firſt poynt wee may well haue eye promiſſes god hathe made v namely wee ſhall loze labour ſeruing bee diſappoynted longing rewarde greate heauen yet notwithſtanding meane time ſeruice doo vnto god muſt bee free harted witte whē ſoeuer pleaſeth hym plague v wee muſt therefore ceaſſe continue obedience towardes walke hys feare wel dealt gently v mainteyned v good plight hereof ye ſee muſt loke haue hyrelings rewarde ſay ô ſerue god conditionally hee deale mine owne deſire wee come poynte ſeruing god manner child manner thoſe hyred wage day vvhat done wee muſt haue freeharted affection dedicate ſelues wholy vnto god giue ſelues wholly ſeruing yea euen well wo weale well aſſured labour ſhall diſappointed wee ſhall haue proceeded ſuch ſimplicitie aſmuche matter layde foorth length nowe keepe reſt till tomorrow let v humble ſelues preſence good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v vnderſtande better wee maye diſlyke ſeeke remedy hee offereth v ende maye bee corrected therewithall guyde v ſuch wyſe worlde wee may deſire nothing pleaſe pointes reſpectes follow hys holy commaundements ſo let v ſay almighty god heauenly father c fiftenth sermon ſecond vpon fourth chapter sermon contayneth yet ſtill expoſition ſixth verſe afterward followeth 7 conſider pray thee vvho euer periſhed beeing innocent vvhere haue vpright bene deſtroyed 8 haue ſeene plough vnrightuouſneſſe ſovv incomberance gather ſame 9 periſhed vvith blaſt god vvere conſumed vvith breath hys mouth 10 roring lyon noyze libarde teeth lyon vvhelpes diſpatched 11 lyon periſheth vvant pray lyoneſſes vvhelpes chaced avvay firſt formoſt wee haue beare mind declared yeſterday ſerue god aright wee muſt bee ledde freeharted affection giue ſelues vntoo withoute hauing reſpect well intreated hand afterward ſend v owne harte deſire thoſe wyll ſo indent wyth god receyue god hand ſoeuer themſelues deſire firſt ſhew themſelues ouerfleſhly much gyuen luſtes ſecondly woulde bynde god ſtraunge faſhion behaue themſelues child towardes theyr father bee driuen ſlauiſhe reſpecte bee hyrelinges wagiſmen vvhat muſte wee doo referring ſelues god good pleaſure muſte haue ſuche conſtancie v honour bothe woe weale deſire bee hys continue obeying ſoeuer hee doo v ſoeuer hee diſpoſe v wee bee mynde ſeruice wee ſhall like hym neuer whit notwithſtanding bee neuer ſo well liked eſteemed worlde therefore lette v referre fearing reuerencing god ende wee would haue doo wee liſte although hee rough ſharpe towards v ſo may ſometymes ſeeme hee would thunder vpon v yet neuertheleſſe lette v abyde ſtill awe ſay lorde reaſon thou ſhouldeſt raigne ouer thy creature alſo childe commaunde father binde hym ſtake ſay sir gouerne mee according good pleaſure proteſt deſire nothing ſubiect vnto behold haue doo ſurely wee know well inough scripture ſheweth v loſt labour ſerue god hath promiſed v plentifull reward ſhall diſappointed expectation yet muſt ſaid freeharted affection go wee make bargayning god ſay bound v according appetities muſt neceſsitie graunt v ſo euer haue imagined owne brayne lo god ſeruants knowing ſeruice acceptable ſhall vnprofitable notwithſtanding reſte themſelues vpon reward promiſed much leſſe muſt intend bring god bente bowe taske neceſsitie doo thys muſt lowlineſſe referre themſelues wholy thing pleaſure whereas ſpeake reward debate whither reward due vnto v ſtand vpon matter vvhen haue done poſsible done god ſhall neuer whit debt promiſeth v reward vnderſtand freegift haue deſerued wee worthy bycauſe hath receyued v fauour ſo alſo allowe workes yea whiche hee hymſelfe doth holy ſpirit touching goodneſſe none v yet looke god hath giuen v accepteth wee brought hym owne receyueth workes ſo owne mere goodneſſe gyue v better courage ſerue hauing eye hys promiſes wherein proteſteth vntoo v rewarde great heauen yea hee bliſſe v thys world alſo ſo wee ſhall want thing may wee caſt eye heerevpon comfort ſelues heerewithall haue ſayde wee muſte recken god ſhould deale v owne deuice rather determine ſelues referre matter wholly vnto ſubmit ourſelues
