wholly good thus ſee doctrine wee haue gather texte profitable v marke whereby diſcerne hypocrite god child hypocrite may well magnifie god full mouthe time proſperitie worlde goe againſt deſire man ſhall ſee chaunged cauſe ſuche maner men beare reuerence godwarde forth hee applyeth himſelfe vnto kinde reuerence minded ſerue mine owne torne one well bicauſe drawe profite make good countenaunce perceiue ſhake like vilaine hee ſerues well nowe mortall men beare ſuch carliſhneſſe ſhall become v come vnto god ſhall loue ſhall honor ſo farre forth may owne profit mockery see order nature peruerted true friendſhip betwene v man wil honor vertues know bee ende wee may liue togither one cōmon accord ſerue god ſay god giueth v ſuch mark may well ſerue honor man may well haue regarde creature nothing touching god hee muſt bee honored owne ſake bicauſe deſerueth muſt ſo rauiſhed honoring may thinke oure ſelues ſauing ſeconde place inferiour degree vvee maye ſee howe hypocrite bewray themſelues repyning againſte god time aduerſitie hee handleth owne fanſie much moſt men giuen vice wee ſee cauſe ought marke leſſon better nowe eliphas addeth conſider euer anye rightuous man haue periſhed marke right dealing men haue beene rooted eliphas haue ſayde alreadie taketh heere good ſentence ſo reaſons bringeth heere againſt iob good holy notwithſtanding caſe bee euill ſurely principle ſet drawne god pure truth reaſon whereof much holy ghoſt pronounced ſaying neuer rightuous man yet periſhed neuer right dealing man bene deſtroyed neither could ſuche thing happen vvhy ſo god hathe promiſed haue care rightuous ſaide eye lorde vpon rightuous eares open prayer heare ſuccour neede scripture full matter wit god hande ſtretched preſerue rightuous call vpon put truſt needes muſt diuell haue bene ſtronger god rightuous might haue periſhed therefore let v alwayes haue recourſe ſentence ieſus chriſte father hath put handes ſtronger meaning welfare ſhall neuer hazarde ſo muche god taketh v keeping vvherefore ſpread power v mainteine v therefore let v conclude welfare good ſuretie god hath taken charge ſo ſure doctrine righteous periſhe right dealing men rooted great difference periſhing afflicting puniſhments affliction ſerue alwayes deſtroy men haue declared partly already yet may affliction ſo grieuous ſomtimes ſeeme deadly vvhat done muſt conclude according haue ſhewed ſo much god chalendgeth office pull men graues need doubt ſhall ſuccored wee haue endured time vve ſee eliphas miſapplieth matter thoughe iob periſhed alreadie god forſaken vtterly without remedy ſo true poore man altogither diſfigured irkſome beholde ſpectacle might ſhew wrath god yet god ceaſſe loue may ſee experience ſheweth ende eliphas therefore preuented dread maketh miſdeeme ſo muche hee leaueth roome god mercy • meere goodneſſe lo wherein ouerſhot himſelfe alſo ſee mā ſuch miſerable plight ſeemeth vtterly fordone hope recouerie let v learne let v learne ſaye magnifie god goodneſſe hope hee yet ſtill remedie miſchiefes ſeeme incurable true mannes expectation may fordone god hath meanes incomprehenſible v whereby ſuccoure ſeruantes hee liſteth ſhewe himſelfe pitifull towardes let v tarie leyſure till hee ſhewe v ende meane let v ſuſpende oure iudgements leaſt iudged ouer haſtie raſhe thus wee ſee wee haue marke namely wee muſt acknowledge power god ſo great able ſuccour thoſe ouerthrowne able quicken againe although already dead muſt applye doctrine neighbor muſt alſo practiſe ech one v himſelf wherefore god ſendeth v many great trouble wee conceiue ſpoken iob neede eliphas vexe v beare v hand paſt recouerie ther none v al hath ſeed harburning ſelfe trouble martyr himſelf affliction yea euen driue v deſpaire owne nature affordeth v god ſcourgeth v troubled ſuch imagination howe nowe god hath promiſed ſuccour ſuch thou pineſt away yea euen extremitie thou calleſt vpon god hee anſwereth thee vvhere promiſes thou ſeeſt well inough hee hath ſhaken thee therefore cauſe thou ſhouldeſt anye thinke accounteth thee thou highe time looke vpon thee pitie thee nowe neuer ſhetteth eye make though hee ſawe thee therefore thou ſeeſt hathe vtterly forſaken thee beholde temptation wherevnto ſubiecte ſteppe v driue v vtterly diſpaire muche haue neede fenſed againſt ſuch conflict maner haue ſayd man mynde caſteth ſuch temptation hee muſt anſwere ſay true neuer rightuous man yet periſhed true right dealing men roted periſhing bee onely afflicted wherefore holy scripture telleth v god rayſeth vp dead hee gyueth courage ſuch vtterly diſmayed recouereth ſuche wounded death vvhen scripture ſayth ſo ſhew god vttereth working towardes afflicted yes ſayde deade alreadie rotten lift vp ſelues receiue yee full liuelyneſſe flouriſh yee freſh herbes eſay ſpeaketh faythfull faithfull muſt ſometimes become lyke rotten carkeſſes god maye gyue liuelyneſſe againe wee ſee hearbes become greene ſpringtime good deade winter euen ſo muſte god worke v bee many ſentences tend vnto ſelf ſame end wee perceiue god preſerueth ſeruauntes one meaneth make cokneys hee myndeth take graues mainteine wonderful faſhyon intent may knowe howe hee belongeth haue dominion ouer death giue life therefore haue warrant iſſues death god hande beholde heere notable promiſſe vvhen dauid intendeth ſhewe v howe god guydeth v hee ſayth iſſues outgoings death belong vnto meaneth bee throwne headlong deathe euery blowe ſet forth one ſteppe ſhal ſeeme wee vtterly vndone god hath iſſues death hande ſayeth hee let v marke well theſe ſentences wee may throughly fenced diuell ſhall come blowe oure eare art thou seeſt thou howe thou haſt ſuccoure aboue rightuous periſh bar satā purpoſe let v haue theſe anſwers readie true rightuous periſh neither periſhed thou arte good dead mā ſayth dieul god let v ſay thathath iſſues deth hand dauid meaneth texte ſaying though ſhadowe death thy ſheepehooke ô lorde ſhall guyde mee bicauſe alwayes put truſt thee thou protector ſhall bee exempted euill thus yee ſee howe wee ought practize leſſon enſueth ſuch ſowe extortion laboure extortion ſuch ſowe incomberance ſhall gather ſame vvhiche thing confirmed ſimilitude eliphas ſayeth roring lyon ſtinted teeth broken whelpes deſtitute praye vvherby hee meaneth ſuch haue bene full crueltie extortion ſhall bee daunted hande god ſomewhat afore hee ſayde wicked periſhed blaste god breath mouthe touching former ſentence ſayde ſuche labour iniquitie ſowe trouble incomberance c ſay ſimilitude taken tiller earth ſayde two wordes iniquitie trouble one vnrightuouſneſſe incomberaunce ioyned togither scripture ſignifie extortion outrage wicked commit vexe diſquiet neighbour alſo worde incomberance trouble ſpoken ſuche doe nothing toſſe turmoyle men firſt ſayde plough bycauſe ſo deſirous anoy neyghbours doe ſome harme doe make preparatiues like laborour intendeth ſowe grounde hee muſt firſt plough earth muſt firſt tilled euen ſo wicked conſulte aforehande vpon vngraciouſneſſe trecheries vnlawfull dooings deuyſing guyles deceytes afterwarde haue layde whole platforme ſeeke meanes poſsible put lewde enterpriſes execution verie laboring tillage eliphas ſpeaketh ſayth heerevpon ſowe incomberance ſaye haue made preparation runne vpon poore men fleece eate vp theſe men ſayeth hee doe reape haue ſowed ſaye god maketh miſchiefe whiche haue conceyued inuented againſt others lyght vpon owne heades vvee ſee heere ſentence true wee muſte take ſpoken holy ghoſt euen gather generall leſſon thereof put true vſe muſt pray god graunt v ſpirit wiſdome behalf may wreſt scripture way way draw contrarie ſenſe weſee eliphas hath done wheras holy scripture ſayeth ſuche plough iniquitie ſowe incomberance ſhall reape ſame threatning god vttereth againſt wicked thinke aduaunce themſelues highly playe rauenous beaſtes fleecing one man eating vp another ſpecially deuour ſeeming themſelues bee iolly conquerours ſtanding owne conceytes ſo lorde telleth beguile themſelues verie muche hee maketh enterpriſes turne owne confuſion vvherfore ye ſee threatning whereby god purpoſeth repreſſe ouer boldeneſſe maliciouſneſſe men minding holde ſhort intent may liue togiether good loue vpright dealing ſo man may labour hinder neighbour like contrarie ſide heare alſo promiſſe giuen v theſe wordes ſoweth bliſſedneſſe ſhall reape ſame sainct paule ſpeaketh almeſdeedes hee ſayeth wee ſowe vpon oure neighboures god gyueth vnto v ſhall gatheir againe ſo much wee ſhall haue abundance gracious giftes bliſsinges god ſhall ſhead rich vpon v ſhewe himſelfe gracious liberall towardes v bee neceſsitie promiſſe ſerueth giue faithfuil good mynde deale frankly neighbour ſuccour nowe ſee true vſe leſſon wee muſt keepe oure ſelues well practyzing anye anoyance deceyte ſo little ſhall wee bee able aduaunce ſelues theſe wicked practyzes vnlawfull meanes god ſhall put v confuſion ende vvee ſee howe wee ought repreſſe wicked luſtes wee maye deale vprightly reaſonably neighboures ſide muche noyſomneſſe extortion diſpleaſe god let v bee well ware behaue oure ſelues vprightly ſay let v labour well ſo euery one v may onely abſteine miſdealing alſo conſider god haue giuen v abilitie muſte profit one another cōmunicate mutually altogither heerevnto lette v alſo gather togyther ſentences holy scripture tende ſame ende curſed bee thou robbeſt thou ſhalte bee robbed thy turne come afterwarde looke meaſure men make ſame ſhall bee giuen againe vvhen wee heare theſe ſayinges let v vnderſtande god doth euermore turne miſchiefe wicked men deuiſed vpon themſelues scripture ſpeaking wicked perſone ſayeth hee ſhall fall pit hee hathe digged afterwarde iudgement wythout mercie ſhall hee haue whiche mercileſſe vnpitifull vvhen wee heare ſuche ſentences lette v tremble bee circumſpecte walke ſo iuſtly vprightly neighboures men maye knowe wee bee continually reſtrained feare god thus wee ſee wee haue marke effect ſentence way man vexed haue doone good perſecuted ſeketh liue peace concorde neighbour muſt conclude hee companie thoſe gather trouble incomberance bycauſe ſowed ſo wee heare howe holy scripture ſayeth contrarie namely god dothe ſomtimes ſuffer ſuch thing trie pacientneſſe ſuch vvee ſee example reported v holy scripture dauid proteſteth hee ſought nothing concorde yet notwithſtanding hee troubled leſſe hee prouoked enimies hee giuen cauſe doe diſpleaſure hee ſayeth hee hated without cauſe heerein hee ſhewed himſelfe true member ieſus chriſte therefore wee muſte come backe saincte peter ſayth yea euen alledging pſalme vvho ſo ſayeth hee deſirous proſper bee bliſſed god leade quiet life let ſeeke peace giue himſelfe well lo god promiſeth v witte ordinarie bliſsing wee bee giuen well hee guyde v ſuffer v bee racked oute meaſure neuertheleſſe yee ſuffer weldoing thanke god ſayeth hee whereas hee ſayeth yee ſeeke bee peace euerye man yee ſhall fynde immediately hee addeth ſhall alwayes bee ſo much vnthankefulneſſe worlde wicked ſhall deale lewdely thoſe haue ſoughte nothing welfare wee ſee man afflicted wee muſte conclude hee ſo dealt ſowing iniquitie ſowing trouble incomberance wee knowe cauſe god viſiteth ſuche wyſe true ſhall haue knowne one haue beene wicked perſone god iudgement viſible notorious vpon man haue beene deſpyzer god ſuch one hath ledde lawleſſe lyfe offence others wee iudge scripture telleth v wee wyll iudge firſte daſhe withoute knowing partie onely wee ſee ſcourged therevpon ſaye curſed beholde raſhe ouerpreſumptuous iudgement ſuch one god findeth faulte withall therefore wee muſt haue ſtaye ſelues proceede ſuche myldeneſſe aduiſedneſſe haue ſhewed heeretofore eliphas hath ſpoken ſo addeth ſuch maner men wit practyſed deceit violence oppreſſe neighbour haue put wicked practizes execution ſhall bee deſtroyed blaſte god breath mouth vvherby ſheweth althoughe men ceaſſe duty yet god ceaſſeth doe puniſhing ſuche ſo gyuen outrage crueltie anoyance thing verye true well worthye bee throughly marked v wherefore thing hardeneth wicked cauſeth goe theyr vngraciouſneſſe bycauſe beare themſelues hande manne dare open lippes againſte men ſtande feare behaue themſelues like wilde beaſtes euery man ſhoulde ſtande ſuch awe world ſhould quake onely looke haue pilled polled euer man ſpeake againſt bycauſe haue wherewith currie fauour ſuche may anoy according wee ſee howe thoſe haue vſed ſuche wycked practyzes haue alwayes brybes hande ſtop mouthes maye puniſhe muche therefore wicked gyue ſelues ſuche miſdealing hope ſcape puniſhment man hande ſayde ſhall bee deſtroyed blaſte god ſaye although men omitte duetie ſo iuſtice executed whiche haue vſing ſwoorde holde peace playe dumbe idolles ſo man mainteine right reaſon wyckedneſſe borne yet god ydle heauen lette v beare mynde whole worlde ſooth v vppe naughtineſſe yet ſhall oure cace bee neuer better neyther ſhall wee haue gayned anye thing beeyng ſo flattered oure vyces men handes wee muſt come account heauenly iudge beholde heere ſpeciall poynt wee haue marke therefore l • non blyndfolde owne eye giue ouer himſelfe naughtineſſe hee ſeeth hee may ſaye vvell plucke thing ſelfe man dare ſpeake againſt mee yea wee heare howe ſayde heere men giue v libertie doe euill god ydle meane whyle hee bolſter euill hath hee tolde v lyke hee neare ſuche call vpon ſo alſo hee beholdeth marketh eye wicked thoſe doo men violence extorcion ſeeing caſe ſo let prouoke v walke feare aſſuring ſelues wee muſt yeelde account iudge wee ſhall haue gayned nothing fauour men thus ſee haue marke ſentence great weyght ſayde wicked periſhe blaſte god breath mouth herein ſignifyed vnto v god needeth make great preparation arme himſelfe intendeth repreſſe ſuche ſtubborne deuour thinges giue themſelues guilefulneſſe deceiue neighbor ſpecially full crueltie extortion deuoure whole worlde god needeth leuie great power men ſtrengthen himſelf withall needeth ſeeke meanes heere howe ouerthrowe let blowe vpon behold diſpatched nowe therefore wee ſee maner ſpeaking wherein ſayde wicked periſh blaſt god breath mouthe importeth verie much like eſay alſo ſpeaking men generally ſetteth v downe ſelfe ſame blaſt ſhew v brittle ſtate therefore wee haue neede bee mainteined god elſe ſhall hazarde periſhing euery minute houre furthermore make v vnderſtand although wicked haue full ſcope worlde triumphe bee bothe ſtoute ſtrong ſo ſeeme inuincible yet needeth great force deſtroy blaſt god bee inough diſpatche quite cleane nowe let v come ſayde concerning kingdome lorde ieſus chriſt ſayde power referred breath mouth worde wit wicked ſhall bee rooted behold howe eſay ſpeaketh paule applieth ſame texte latter comming oure lorde ieſus chriſte howe ieſus chriſte reigneth enimies confounded ſimple worde blaſt needeth thūderbolts ouerthrowe sith caſe ſtandeth ſo let v looke ſelues ofte goſpell preached god thundereth vpon deſpiſers thereof vppon ſuch become harde hearted ſtubborne againſt true tyme wee perceiue force worde puniſhing wicked yet ende ſhall fayne fele vaine god hath ſaid prophet confirmed apoſtle ieſus chriſte ſhall deſtroy wicked blaſte mouth vertue word therfore feare ſaide ſentence let v ſubmit ſelues goſpell fele force incloſed ſame owne confuſion rather ſee experience welfare thus much concerning text afterwarde ſimilitude lion lioneſſes lioneſſes whelpes ſhall ſcattered deſtroyed dout eliphaſsis meaning god ſtretched ſtrong arme againſt ſuch outrageous violent againſt men ſhorte reſemble lion wylde beaſtes ſee effect true ſee meeke one ſo afflicted ſeemeth god woulde breake brooze piece haue example dauid yet ſentence ceaſſeth true ſpecially conſider god iudgements proceedeth moſt commonly touching puniſhmentes god layeth vpon world rule made without exception vvhen ſayde ſuche mercileſſe ſhall haue iudgement without mercie wee muſt vnderſtand point caſes according preſent courſe thing ſee neither muſt conclude ſuche cruelly perſecuted haue therefore bene cruell vvee ſee befell oure lorde ieſus chriſt head mirrour patterne god child vvee ſee alſo hathe befalne moſt faithfull haue erſt ſayde muſt take ordinarie iudgement ſo wee heare promiſſe contrarie parte bliſſed meeke ſhall inherite earth ieſus chriſt telleth v mylde louing wee liue gently among neighbor wee indeuer euery man good ſhall enioy earth ſay ſhall continue quietneſſe wee ſhall troubled yea haue declared ment hereby ſhal exempted inconueniences god cauſe ſhall poſſeſſe earth verely ſo farre forth ſhall expedient v lo haue beare remembrance let v thinke thing ſtraunge whiche ſpoken texte witte lion teeth ſhall bee broken roaring make ſhall bee ſtinted ſay god ſtretch arme power daunt ſuch ſo full pryde fierceneſſe ſeke nothing eate vp deuour god therefore ſheweth arme bee ſtrong wee ordinarily ſee wherevpon ſhall god ſhewe iudgementes great notable vppon theſe lion like woode beaſtes ſet vpon ſpoyle yea glutted man bloud vve ſee howe god ſheweth himſelfe iudge notably caſe vpon little one vpon thoſe haue exerciſed ſuch violence therefore let v learne afrayde god iudgementes preuent oft executeth ſuch thing vpon thoſe giuen hurt neighbor let v glorify aſſuring ourſelues wil iudge whole world haue pitie ſuch wrongfully vexed ſo ende hee bee ſafetie ſhewe verye deede neuer forgate euen ſeemed vtterly caſt vvhat done wee muſt looke vpon god iudgementes ſuch wyſe wee may perceiue ſheweth world stage whervpon god ſetteth v forth many example muſt turne behoues wee maye walke feare abſteyning euill good oure neyghbours walking ſoundly vprightly among reſpectes wee ſo doubte wee ſhall feele power oure god maintein v notwithſtāding muſt faine walk many miſeries world bee ſhort although wee among thouſande deathes perceyue yet helpe promiſeth yet ſhall wee ceaſſe mainteined wonderful maner let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceiue better wee haue doone heretofore hauing eye promyſes whereby allureth v ſo gently vnto wee maye warrante oure ſelues wee walke feare hee neuer forget v although wee haue offended ſo manye wayes wee bee well worthie bee ſhaken sathan alſo would make v beleeue wee ſhall bee receiued mercye yet notwithſtanding wee muſt bee fayne walke many miſeries world bee ſhort although wee among thouſande deathes perceiue yet helpe promiſeth yet ſhall ceaſſe mainteined wonderfull maner let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceyue better wee haue doone heeretofore hauing eye promiſes whereby allureth v ſo gently vntoo wee maye warrant ſelues wee walke feare hee neuer forget v although wee haue offended ſo many wayes wee bee well worthie ſhaken sathan alſo would make v beleeue ſhall receiued mercy yet notwithſtanding wil cauſe v know hath pardoned v yea readie receiue v time often come backe may reſt vpon promiſes performance hereof let v pray ſo guyde v ſame may atteine perfectfulneſſe benefites hee hathe promiſed v hee hath prepared v heauen maye pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c ſixteenth sermon third vpon fourth chapter 12 one thing hath bene brought ſecret vvhereof myne eare hath heard little 13 among thought nightviſions vvhen men ſleepe 14 fearefulneſſe trembling came vpon made bone afrayde 15 vvynde vvhisked made haire bodie ſtare 16 ſtoode one knevve face vvas image myne eye heard voyce ſilence 17 man rightuous god man pure maker 18 beholde findeth ſtedfaſtneſſe ſeruants hath put vanitie angel 19 hovve much dvvell houſes clay vvhoſe foundation duſte vvhich conſumed deſtroyed mouth eliphas hathe ſhewed reaſon iob ſerued god faithfully pure heart leaſt wiſe affection doe ſo addeth god authoritie ſhewe iob neither ought meanes reply ſhould condemned god good right men thinke eliphas boſteth hauing ſome reuelation neuertheleſſe well conſidered doubt pretending god reueled ſuch matter vnto matter certaintie wee muſt hold principle theſe general ſentences hee alledgeth good yet illapplied muſt thinke ſtrange god ſhould inſpire maner noweadayes taught faſhion father age god ſpeaketh vnto v ſuch wiſe prophet inſtruments holie ghoſt haue goſpell wherein god ſheweth himſelfe familiarly let v looke vpon manner ſpeaking whiche god vſeth noweadayes church hee hath diſcloſed whole vnto v holie scripture time paſte god opened himſelfe ſuche pleaſed ſhewe ſpeciall fauour howe viſions holie scripture witneſſeth let v aſſure ſelues eliphas excellent man therefore muſt thinke ſtrange god ſhoulde appeere vnto viſion night ſhoulde knowe thing whiche scripture teacheth v daye pretending matter falſe brag eliphas doth dout caſe miſapplye thing euill purpoſe perſon iob whiche bin reueled vnto end vſe ſee god ſheweth men ought walke lowlyneſſe behold whervnto viſion giuē tendeth wit men ſhould ſtande owne conceite bee puffte vp pryde thinke themſelues rightuous great woorthineſſe ſhould vnderſtande come ſhewe themſelues god nothing ſinne thē reaſon whereof muſt needes confounded therfore muſt haue eye corruption ſorie ſame eliphas receiued ſuch maner doctrine good nowe layeth burthen vpon iob thinketh himſelfe haue woone ſpurs ouercharging ſerued god faithfully vvee ſee generall caſe eliphas boaſteth vaine bin taught god playeth yll ſcholer point taketh heede himſelfe intendeth oppreſſe iob contrarie truth let v come lay forth whole matter particularly hee ſayeth thing brought ſecrete eare hearde little yea ſayth hee viſion night heard blast whisked hither thither laſt voyce whiche ſpake ſilence true addeth alſo image whereas hee ſayeth hee knewe ſauing hee abaſhed euen hee ſhuddered bodie ouer heares fleſhe ſtoode ſtaring vp feare aſtoniſhemente traunce tendeth ſhewe reporteth dreames verye teſtimonie god whiche muſte bee receiued authoritie heereby wee ſee viſions whiche auncient father god dyd ſ • certaine token amaze put ſome terrour feare ſerued authorize woorde ende ſhould bee receyued better ſee howe men ſo well inclyned heare god ſpeake ought bee except hee make feele maieſtie man ſome greate eſtate ſpeake vntoo v wonder ſee wee bee earneſt hearken vnto wee bee heare reade holie scripture vvherof commeth carnall beaſtly remedie ſuch faultineſſe hath pleaſed god giue alwayes ſome token maieſtie intent worde might bee receyued men ſhould take bee greater credit authoritie alſo mention made viſions holie scripture alwayes ſayde holie father haue bene ſtricken ſome feare without cauſe ſo behoued bee prepared humilitie might obey god ſimply yet another reaſon although wee ſeeme well minded heare god yet capacitie receiue hee telleth v except fleſhe tamed inwarde pryde v puffeth v vp ſuch ſort knowe good conuenient v vntill ſuch tyme god hath ſtricken v downe thus ſee wherefore god neuer appeared vntoo men hee gaue ſome feeling feare namely end ſhould like well themſelues ſtand much vpon owne reputation truſt much owne ſtrength nowe wee perceiue wherunto long deſcription eliphas maketh referred ſayth ſecrete matter whereof ſmall intelligence true firſt bluſh may ſeeme trifling calleth ſecrete god ſhould leaſtwiſe rightuous men hee concludeth end men haue regarded ſo rightuous euery man confeſſeth woordes ſo muche verie heathen haue euer gaynſayde vvhat myſterie secrete matter let v aſſure ſelues thā neceſſarie although men agree point none ryghtuous onely god bee full infirmity compariſon yet notwithſtanding wee acknowledge ſufficiently neyther ſufficiently imprinted v wee fully throughly perſuaded god ryghtuouſneſſe owne naughtineſſe certayne wee ſhould doubt wee commonly doo ſhould grudgings bee hearde mouthes ſhoulde bee gayneſaying replying heartes wee ſhould bee altogither quiet ſo euer ſhould pleaſe god put v ſhame wee could confeſſe hee good right ſo cace ſtandeth ſo ye ſhall ſee men kick againſt god aſſoone toucheth nay ſpare ſinnes doe warne come true knowledgement ſo man may perceiue hereby men puffed vppe preſumptuouſneſſe knowe god rightuouſneſſe might humble themſelues vnder therefore without cauſe eliphas termeth heere ſecrete god ſheweth himſelfe rightuous men ought bee aſhamed want knowledge themſelues wretched ſame manner alſo doth sainct paule take telleth romaine howe vnknowne ſecrete thing vntoo men god purpoſed vtter foorth rightuouſneſſe ieſus chryſt end worlde ſhould acknowledge themſelues indetted vntoo god true man ſay anye difficultie heerein yet haue ſhewed afore men attribute wote themſelues fynde theyr heart vncace ſelues ſayd vayne ouerſtatelineſſe ſo much owne opinion thinke ſelues able woorke wonder free heerevpon beare themſelues hande ſhall purchace rewarde god hande contrariwyſe god knowne bee onely rightuous nothing wickedneſſe bee founde men thus much concerning poynte eliphas ſaying hee hearde little ſayde woord ſheweth well exalted himſelfe farre taketh vpon perfection wiſedome ſaye nothing eſcaped hee comprehended euery whit vttermoſte hee ſayth hee ſome taſte ſayde doctrine god conceyued ſome parte vvee ſee hee ſpeaketh modeſtly declaring angell heauen ſo could behold god glorie full ſight according man rudeneſſe bene taught know communicate thing vnto neighbour receiued god lo ment ſay effect hereby admoniſhed howe familiarly ſo euer god ſheweth himſelfe vnto v great matter wee admitted knowe thing part muſt thinke haue ſo perfect vnderſtanding may bee lacke thinke ſo themſelues beguile themſelues thereby ſhet themſelues gate open come afore ſo let marke well much done v haue little taſte enterance knowledge god truth meant prophetes teacher god hath chozen ordeyned vnto whome hath gyuen moſt excellent gyftes wee ſee example eliphas ſhall ſayd v ſet v one ſimple cōmon ſort people one whome god himſelfe hath appeared yet telleth v heard little behold haue marke firſte place truely throughly perſuaded ſhould ſuche ouerweening ſeene talke euery v beares himſelfe hande ignorant nothing leaſt exercyſed holy scripture needes haue reputation themſelues bee ſo ſuttle ſharpwitted ſpeake nothing good reaſon though holie ghoſt ſleeue whence commeth ſuch pryde yet apcee imagine themſelues vnderſtand thinges furthermore pryde accompanied careleſneſſe moſte part paſſe perfit themſelues ſo weene bee come perfection knowledge many men haue heard two three word goſpell ye ſhall ſee ſo full bee paſſe learning knowledge needes teach men ſhort doctor god laugheth ſuch preſumption skorne little myght haue receiued muſt taken ſo ſhall go away emptie according written ſong virgin marie ſuch full winde eſteeming themſelues rych ſtanding vpon reputation haue bin ſtarued hunger let v learne praiſe god ſuch wiſe hath giuen v ſo know haue neede proceede dayly may haue earneſt deſire profit come modeſtie familiarly wee bee taught concerning god worde ſo much muſt bee little ſcholers wee ſtep ſuch pride thinke al brain come according abilitie haue ſayd muſt bee none hath perfection wiſedome ſaue ieſus chriſt intent may deale euery man meaſure certeine portion furthermore let v marke well circumſtance place treateth god rightuouſneſſe whereof haue ſpoken knowing full ſinnes corruptiōs end may apply whole ſtudie ſame doctrine aſſuring ſelues wel ſhall neuer bring throughly paſſe vvherfore behoueth v mynde ſo much apply whole lyfe therevnto bene throughly knowne men falne ſo horrible darkeneſſe papacie ſeemeth ſuperfluous thing treate free iuſtification fayth counte madde doctrine skoffe v ſtanding ſomuch vpon yea heere ſhewed v euen thoſe haue vſed viſions heauen haue muche vnderſtande little ſuch ſecrecie let v vnderſtande behoueth v diligent article haue imployed wittes yet ſhall comprehende hundreth part proofe heereof god rightuouſneſſe infinit thing corruption sea bottomleſſe pitte therefore muſt maruell eliphas telling v heere hee ſmall taſte article let v nowe come hee addeth breath winde went fro ſo die quaked ſhuddered heare ſtoode vppe ſtiffe throughout bodie appeered image vnto hee knewe ende heard voyce ſilence done ende haue touched wit make eliphas readie receiue god purpoſed ſaye prepare ſuche wiſe might vnderſtand howe god ſpake ende doctrine might bee authoritie furthermore eliphas might bee humbled ſo hee might bee hoiſſed vp preſumption according men commonly chalenge themſelues wote behoued eliphas altogither abaſed end might know owne want giue glorie vnto god true theſe dayes haue ſuch viſions time paſt behoueth v knowe whereas god gaue ſuch ſignes auncient father muſt ſerue v alſo day therefore reade holie scripture come sermon wee muſt bee touched maieſtie god yeelde reuerence ſo wee defile holie truth eſteeming man ſhould tell v ſome merie conceyted tale rather thinke thus seeing maker ſpeaketh vnto v behoueth knee bowe men ought quake ſayth lo haue mark ſentēce moreouer know god publiſhing lawe ſhewed token affray ſuch ment teach time therevpon people ſayd let v come neere mountaine ſhall al die god ſpeak vnto v thus ye ſee god authorize lawe ſuch wiſe people vtterly diſmaid reaſon great number miracle ſhewed done ſakes onely time god ment giue v alſo knowledge power whiche permanent vnto world ende goſpel hath yet greater proofe maieſtie ther nothing either ought hinder v frō receiuing goſpel except vnthankfulneſſe vngraciouſneſſe put oure eye although wee ſee wonder god hath ſhewed yet muſt hold ourſelues cōtented god teacheth v worde wythout longing newe viſions many wandring ſpirites doe whiche woulde angel ſhoulde come downe heauen bring ſome newe reuelations heerein doe god great wrong content themſelues god hath ſhewed himſelfe ſo familiarly vnto v ſeeing haue holy scripture certaine wee wante thing aboue thinges brightneſſe goſpell wee haue perfection wiſdome sainct paule ſheweth syth cace ſtandeth ſo tickled fonde deſire haue ſome viſions doe well bewraye neuer knewe holy scripture let v contente v whiche hathe pleaſed god diſcloſe vnto v well prophetes sonne oure lorde ieſus chriſte aſſuring ſelues maketh v finall concluſion without paſsing hereby wee ſee whereunto come haue ſuch deſyre raunge abroade leape beyonde boundes heere ſee whence came horrible confuſion popedome heere wee ſee wherevpon pope groundeth doctrine hee ſayth apoſtles haue declared profyte churche holy ghoſte come make men frame newe article make men reſte themſelues vpon holy councels much pope hanger haue hild themſelues pureneſſe holie scripture god hath vndoubtedly blinded owne folie wee ſee ſome among bee ſo dull brutiſhe finally haue beene growne ſo farre kynde worſhippe ſtones ſtockes timber thing ſo farre ſquare euen little babe might well aſhamed commeth diueliſh curioſitie bee contented taught ſimply holy scripture beholde alſo wherevpon religion turkes founded mahomet hath reported himſelfe bee partie ſhoulde bring full reuelation ouer beſydes goſpell meanes thereof vtterly become brute beaſtes day wee ſee thoſe poore beaſtes buzie heades doltiſhe vnſenſible thing bee iuſte vengeance god hath gyuen ouer wilfull ſtubborne mynde much hathe bene doone fantaſticall perſones ſpecially dayes haue troubled churche would need haue viſions one article curſed creature seruet burnt ſayde holy ghoſte reygned yet hee come wycked creature diſhonored god thoughe father olde tyme ſhadowe holie ghoſte though ſhedde himſelfe viſibly vpon apoſtles hee retyred agayne incontinently ſuche ſorte churche hath beene deſtitute holy ghoſte beholde hee ſette downe reſpect himſelfe would haue made himſelfe mahomet haue holy ghoſt cōmaundement man may ſee diuell caried away requiſite god ſhould bring ſome ſuch men poynt end might abhor part let v followe order haue told alreadie wit let v taught according rule god hath ordeyned let v ſo headie bynde god agree deſires faſhions let v content v holy scripture ſeeing god hath incloſed v within boundes thereof futhermore touching eliphas ſayeth hearde voyce ſilence ſhewe god prepared ſuch wiſe hee bare awaye ſpoken vnto man rauyſhed traunce may well heare thing yet haue remembrance commeth againe himſelfe ſo many come sermon doe heare well matter treated ſettleth ſo much one aske treated cannot tell one worde ſo prouerbe ſayth wittes woolgathering one muſed thing another houering aire ſetled giue eare vnto god ſuch vaine fancy conceyue come myndes many turmoyles hinder v gyuing ſuch eare audience vnto god wee ought giue thoſe wander owne imagination comprehende theſe thing ſay ſee leſſon whiche ought bee common among v wee muſt bee fully ſettled faythe cauſe eliphas ſayeth voyce came ſilence ſtilneſſe god ſo diſpoſed preſuppoſed ſtoode hande giue eare attentiue ſhould ſpoken vnto haue touched alreadie namely come heare god worde wee muſt haue wittes rouing manner muſt holde ſhort giue diligent hearing vnto god ſo fleſhely affection vanity carie v vnto wickedneſſe turne v hither thither way ſhort wee muſt bee quiet heare god haue ſayde ende ſame may rightly vnderſtoode v vvee ſee wee haue gather vpon ſentence nowe let v come doctrine eliphas handleth heere shall man rightuouſer god ſhall man rightuous maker beholde hee findeth ſtedfastneſſe truth ſeruantes hee hath iudged follie vanitie angelles howe ſhall doe dwell houſes claye firſt place heere eliphas ſetteth downe ſentence theme hee groundeth himſelfe vpon vnreaſonableneſſe men deſire glorifie themſelues compariſon maker muſt men needes deſtitute wit reaſon ſo gloryfie ſelues comparing themſelues god lo heere theme grounde much men eaſily abyde haue owne authoritie condemned behold reaſon hee addeth confirme doctrine god ſhoulde examine angel hee ſhould finde fault hee ſhould finde ſtedfaſt ſhould perceiue themſelues vaine weake creature nowe angel ſuch ſhall become men dwell houſes claye bodie foundation hath firmeneſſe ſo euer ſeemeth bee needes one little ſhoure raine waſhe quite away ſith caſe ſtandeth ſo let v aſſure ſelues wee ſtande god preſence wee come thither preſuming bring rightuouſneſſe owne conſidering verye angel able doe thus ſee effect ſayde vnto v heere haue conſider meant mention made angel imagining bee agaynſt reaſon god ſhould finde angelles throughly rightuous haue concluded ment concerning thoſe angelles continued obedience god thoſe falne become renegates diuels god angel kept ſtate wherein god created fell horrible fall ſo much fayne mirrours damnation vvee ſee maner diuers haue expounded texte namely ſeeing ſtedfastneſſe theſe angel fell looked men whoſe foundation clay muſt ſeke forced expoſitions magnifie angel place ſpeaketh god ſeruants tytle honorable eliphas would haue ſayde god hath founde ſtedfastneſſe ſeruants hee would haue ſayde beholde diuelles heretofore appoynted ſeruice god nowe falne ſuche horrible faſhion fall thing brought wauering ſo much euē mankind alſo come like perdition drawne ſelfe ſame decay eliphas woulde haue ſpoken ſo ſayth god found truth angelles hee founde follie vanitie hee ſayeth founde rebellion backeſliding ſayth onely vanitie greater maner ſpeeche well conſidered doubt eliphas ſpeaketh heere angelles ſerue god giue themſelues wholly therevnto meaneth hee ſaying ſtedfaſtneſſe rather vanitie vnſtedfaſtneſſe vvhen sainct paule ſayeth none immortall onely god certayne excludeth creature yet wee know angel immortall ſpirites god hath created purpoſe ſhoulde returne nothing ſoule man may tyme dye howe ſhall wee make theſe ſentences agree angelles created lyue euerlaſtingly none immortall onely god ſolution eaſie aungels immortall bycauſe ſuſteyned power aboue bicauſe god mainteyneth beeing immortall nature ſelfe verie fountaine lyfe ſayde pſalme lorde fountayne lyfe dwelleth thee thy light ſhall wee ſee light ſeeing lyfe god onely yet notwithſtanding ſame hinderance ſpredding lyfe creature becauſe proceedeth grace wee perceyue howe aungels immortall yet haue ſtedfaſtneſſe themſelues haue nede god ſtrengthen meere goodneſſe vvithout thing woulde happen vnto whiche ſpoken hundred fourth pſalme ſayeth thou withdraweſt thy ſpirite decayeth vvhat gyueth liuelineſſe aungelles heauen ſpirite god ſo wee ſee haue thing themſelues giuen god neyther could inioy euer god ſhould cōtinue ſayd grace hath put like wee ſpeake lyfe ſo muſt wee ſpeake righteouſneſſe alſo aungels ſtedfaſt foorth god holdeth vp hād rightly called principality power bicauſe god executeth power guideth bee ſhorte angel haue nothing thēſelues whereof make boaſt power ſtedfaſtneſſe haue holde god ſo much indetted touching followeth namely god findeth putteth hebrew worde importeth god putteth follie vanitie implyeth vanity angelles commeth god meening hee putteth chargeth iudgement ſay iudge giueth ſentence folly vanitie ſay faultineſſe angelles yea could ſtande would deale rigorouſly verily ſeemeth ſtraunge ſuche exerciſed holy ſcripture wee wiſte righteouſneſſe god wee ſhould marueyle angel themſelues found faultie ſhould cōpare himſelfe muſt alwayes come back poynt good thing creature ſmall eſtimation whiche god vtterly infinite therefore muſt alwaies put difference betweene one vve ſee angel haue wonderfull power vertues ſpecially reſpect v notwithſtanding angel abide degree creature yet may wee well glorifie thē come god greatneſſe muſte ſwallowe vp reſte likewiſe wee ſee howe sūne darkneth starres skie sunne planet well reſt yet neuertheleſſe bicauſe god hath graunted creature haue brightneſſe starres muſt needes ouerſhadowed ſo starre cā pereeyued sunne hath full power bee done thē whē god himſelfe cōmeth foorth prophet eſay ſayth ſhall neither sunne moone brightneſſe god ſhall ſuche ſhall ſeene knowne ouer vvhen eſay ſpeaketh god kingdome ſheweth thing muſte bee done away nothing glorified onely god seeing ſo let v referre alſo ſpoken wit god findeth lacke angelles although bee ſeruantes yet let ſeruice angel vnto god perfect according perfection creature likewiſe reſpect praying wee deſire god may done earth heauen wee witneſſe vntowardneſſe obedience angel yeeld vnto reigneth thē ſuch peaceable maner wholly conformable muſt alwaies beare minde haue touched long go degree ſtate creature ſhall perfection angel verily ſuch perfectiō may creature come vnto god ſayd perfection ſwallowed vp like starres appeere sunne giues light furthermore behoueth v marke well paule ſayeth ieſus chriſt come gather togither thing heauen earth therby ſheweth angelles haue ſtedfaſtneſſe grace lord ieſus chriſt forſomuch hee mediator betwene god creature true ieſus chriſt redemed angel needed raunſomed frō death whervnto yet falne yet mediator ſo intent ioyne thē vnto god al perfectiō afterward mainteyne thē grace may bee preſerued falling nowe ſeeing god findeth faultineſſe angel ſay haue ſtedfaſtneſſe thā mainteyned frō aboue thought v vve muſt bee faine come eliphas addeth mē ſuch glory yea ſuch power angel heauen let cace cōſidered created dwell corruptible tranſitorie lodging brag wee much wee liſt yet nothing vanitie v ſay body duſt poulder muſte go corruption thē ſeeing wee dwell houſes clay excellenter thoſe dwell glorie god beholde face alreadie angelles beeing ſubiect chaunges turning world dwell alreadie heauenly immortality find experience lyfe better blaſt looke diſpatched worlde euery minute houre sith cace ſtandeth ſo commes paſſe preſume ſo ſelues ſhort ſtedfaſtneſſe men doth ſlip vaniſhe away thē caſe ſtāde betwene god v let v learne haue good regard one ſide wit vnto god true vnderſtād mighty power apperteineth angel much neerer thā behold face haue ſuch perfection ſome fault may found hee liſt examine rigor vvhat ſhall become v conſider owne weakneſſe ſhal become vertues would cōpare thē angel ſo noble excellēt creature thus ſee haue remēber ſentēce reſidue cānot declared preſent let v fall face good god acknowledgement faultes praying ſo diſpoſe v receyuing worde wee may come heedleſly thing heare may run one care wee may beare away imprint thē throughly hart make v chaunge wicked affectiōs renounce ſelues quite ridde vaine truſt ſelues wee may deſire nothing worſhip greate god yeeld prayſe deſerueth ſpecially ineſtimable grace giueth v lord ieſus chriſt loue hee hath ſhewed v ſpared deliuered death v may make v ſo feele frute effectualneſſe hath purchaſed v death paſsion ende may bee receyued righteous giltleſſe god father may pleaſe graunt grace onely vnto v alſo c ſeuententh sermon fourth vpon fourth chapter firſte vpon fift chapter sermon conteyneth ſtill expoſition xviij xix verſes fourth chapter followeth 20 morning euening bee deſtroyed bicauſe man ſetteth minde vpon periſh euer 21 doth excellencie go avvay vvith shall periſhe vviſedome nowe followeth fifte chapter 1 call novv aunſvvere thee conſider one sainctes 2 doubtleſſe anger ſleaeth foole enuie killeth vvitleſſe perſon haue ſeene already wherevnto talketendeth witte humble men bycauſe farre perfection angel ſith caſe ſtādeth ſo god liſteth iudge angelles rigor hee ſhoulde finde ſault ynough thē thē ſhould become thē ſo vnable ſay thing themſelues haue nothing thē vanity neuertheles might ſeeme reherſed ſufficiēt proue intent eliphas albeit mē feeble albeit life nothing yet doth therfore follow bee either ſinners faultie god ſeueral thing ſay life trāſitory vaniſheth away euery minute houre ſay god may cōdemne v thing well cōſidered reaſons alleaged fitte purpoſe caſe ſtādeth ſimply vpō men frailtie reſpect body vpō theyr dwelling corruptible fleſh ſo earthly thinke themſelues although haue death cōtinually eies alſo wee muſt marke compariſon ſuch maner forme ſet betweene angel mortall men vve ſee angel nere vnto god beholde glory wholy giuen ſeruice yet ſtedfaſtneſſe thē vphilde grace god might fade vaniſh away thēſelues god meere goodneſſe mainteyned let v come men vvhere dwell bee farre inough frō ſaid heauēly glory ſayd tranſitory lodging elſe body thē ſpeake properly graues body priſons darke hinder v beholding god wee alreadie vnder earth vvhat foundation duſte yet wee conſider ſelues neuer wee continually go decay death threatneth v inceſſantly conſider whitte therefore wee neede woonder though nothing elſe infirmitie men ſeeing angel whiche ſo neere vnto god haue ſo exquiſite perfection god maye condemne liſt enter iudgement ſee argumēt whiche eliphas vſeth fit agreing purpoſe nowe remayneth wey word touched may aduatage ſelues truely man ſpeaketh v ſhortneſſe life thinke nedeleſſe talk knowes nought god ſpeaketh ſo oft putteth v remembrance throughly conceyued life certayne firſte wee woulde bee ſo worldly wee bee neyther woulde oure thought bee ſo blockiſhe bee ſecondly would haue regarde heauenly kingdome reſt ſelues wholly thervpon deſpiſe heauenly life ſo intangled heere wee cannot drawne hence foloweth none v knowe thing euery v confeſſeth ſay life ſhadow paſſeth away mā like floure greene herbe incontinently cut downe withereth ſhort although prouerbs import ouerſhortneſſe worldly life haue alwayes bene rife ynough yet ſtill yet peerce hart v wee ſee warned thinke vpon better surely wee could recken yeares moyſes ſpeaketh thē xc pſalme certeſſe ſhould taught well thinke vpon death alſo tend marke god calles v wote count thē vpon finger behold childhod ſuch differ little nothing brute beaſtes ſauing incōbrance trouble vnderſtanding reaſon ſmall none little one certeſſe draw neere mās eſtate luſtes ſo ouerboyling cānot bridled come man eſtate paſſeth away hand anon old age attacheth v ſo remaineth nothing v weery life put folkes trouble payne wiſt recken race life vpon finger certeynly wee ſhoulde ſuch dullard wee bee therefore let v thinke wee loſe time ſet mindes vpon leſſon witte knowe life nothing hundred thouſand deathes manace v cheefe luſtineſſe haue vvhē kinsfolke friend depart ſee corſe go buriall haue wit ſay man life greate death towne coū trey wee bee yet mooued forgotten v therefore haue wee neede exerciſe ſelues doctrine tyme oure life thus wee ſee scripture ſpeaketh ſo vnto v concerning preſent text ſayd firſt men dwell houſes clay foundation duste ſay wee conſider preſent life ſelfe wherein cōſiſteth beeing incloſed within lodging tende corruption elſe thoſe body behold ſtedfaſtneſſe witte euery whit goeth incontinently vnto duſt conſumed either woormes winde ſay wee bee diſpatched ſoone worme whiche thing nought wee ſcarce eſteeme liuing creature yet conſumed ſooner thus ſee ſayd vnto v firſte place afterward eliphas addeth men periſhe c • nſumed morning vnto euening expounde though ment men periſhe ſmall time verie true herewithall yet wit wee paſſe minute lyfe approching vnto death cōſider well man riſeth morning ſure ſhall ſteppe foorth one pace ſure ſhall take repaſte hee ſure hee ſhall turne hande ſhall ſtill wex elder elder life euer ſhortneth muſt conſider euen eye ſight life fleeteth ſlideth away v thus ſee ment beeing cōſumed morning euening ſayde afterward men periſh euer bycauſe man thinkes vpō vve muſt treate theſe two poynts wee may profit ſelues doctrine one poyntis whatſoeuer ſhould alwayes haue death eye prouoked thinke vpon haue ſayde well knowne among men verie heathen skill ſay ſo euery man playe doctor teaching men conteyned yet meane neuer good ſcholler v behalfe man whiche ſheweth dooings euer knew conſumed morning euening wit luſtineſſe ſeebleneſſe ſtedfaſtneſſe v holde ſelues one cōtinuall ſtate alwaies haſt toward death death towards v ſo muſt needes come thither legnth verily ſingle doctrine alone would ſtand v ſteade make v ſtorme torment ſelues like whē paynim knew life ſo flightfull cōcluded thervpon beſt neuer borne ſooner wee dyed better v lo paynim reiected grace god bicauſe knewe honour doth v ſendeth v worlde euen ſhewe himſelfe father towards v aſmuch wee reaſonable creature haue image god printed oure natur • wee haue record holdeth v childrē deſpiſe ſuch grace ſay bene better v neuer haue bene created apparant blaſphemie ynough v know ſo long bee world wee bee conſumed euery minute houre wee muſt come ſeconde poynt wit haue well behild brittle life muſte alſo marke wee bee repayred agayne god grace ſpecially ſuſteyned vphilde ſame according alſo theſe two poynts matched togither hundreth fourth pſalme ſayde ſoone god withdraweth ſpirite woorking goeth decay yea prophete addeth alſo god ſpredde foorth power renewed worlde thing take liuelineſſe vvee ſee haue marke wit wee know ſelues bee leſſe nothing ſo ſubiect vnto death wee muſte runne thither ye would ſay ſpite teeth muſt vnderſtād alſo ſo greate weakneſſe god holdeth v hand ſo vphild power ſtrengthned grate behold wherein haue reioyce chiefe poynt ſhould haue eye benefit good grace god hath giuen v aboue order nature reſtoring v worde prophet eſay ſayth fleſhe graſſe verily man greene floriſheth withereth vvheras word lorde indureth euer yea cōtinue heauē alſo end may haue euerlaſting life redeemed vniuerſall corruption earthly life god may dwell v make v parttakers euerlaſtingneſſe vve ſee thē wherto muſte come profit ſelues leſſon ſhall ſee yet againe anon furthermore foraſmuch ſee ſelues wanze away ſo faſt frō morning euening go cōtinually decay therfore muſt bee buſier beſtow time wel god giueth v bicauſe ſo ſhort god hath put v world keepe v occupied ſeruice haue long time yet cā diligent earneſt dooing dutie diſcharge ſelu • whē ſhall come poynt god ſeruice body ſoules foraſmuchas ſee needeth turne hand behold laſt caſt ought much earneſter runne according alſo scripture exhorteth v ſhewing v life heere race therefore may go loyteringly euery mā muſt chere vp himſelfe pricke ſpurre forward himſelfe thus wee ſee wee yet note vpon ſentence ſayde men cōſumed away frō morning night let v come eliphas addeth ſayth periſh euer bicauſe man thinketh vpon man might demaunde heere whether wee ſhun death wee thinke vpon nine forty pſalme ſayd wiſe men fooles gathered one herde behoueth v vnderſtand mankind ſhet vp vnder neceſſitie dying wherfore ſayde periſh euer bicauſe none thinke firſte eliphas ment tea • v men wex beaſtly looke thēſelues loke ſpeaketh wee muſt alwayes referre preſent caſe hee maketh generall caſe treate man life trāſitorie without going intendeth ſhew v ſomuch bee poore ſilie creature creeping vpon earth wee cannot attayne perfection angel yet come nere whereas ſayeth periſh euer bicauſe none thinke hee meeneth men go brute beaſtes without iudgement without diſcretion without thinking vpon death long time aforehand therefore taken tardy ſide hee purpoſeth declare men owne nature god hath gathered himſelfe gouerned holy ſpirite end ſhould take hede doctrine behold two poynts wee haue marke touching firſt draweth nere text alleaged euen prophet prophet mocketh careleſneſſe men make account dwell euer notwithſtanding ought well perceyue life wit turning hand ye ſhall ſee broken man think ſhould ſeeme men take pleaſure beguiling forgetting themſelues conſider endes beare themſelues hande idol wilfull ſotting themſelues brutiſhneſſe prophet ſaith folly reproued well knowen experience men deceyue thē ſelues throw themſelues hedlong deſtruction frame themſelues ſuch immortalitie imagine ſhall dwell euer thus ſee follie whiche conuinced euen eyeſight yet ſayth ſo farre poſteritie frō wexing whit wizer gathered thither one flocke like ſheepe graue ſwalloweth vp greate ſmall yet none thinkes vpon see howe geere relieth purpoſe eliphas let v marke holye ghoſt intendeth v vnderſtand foraſmuche wee bee ſo flyghtfull ought haue death alwayes eye ende wee ſhoulde make haſt thitherward attached fearefulneſſe ſhall pleaſe god take v worlde yet amazed wee ſee moſte part bee ſtriken ſuch aſtoniſhmēt know therfore bethinke v great afore hande end ſhall vpon condition created ſhall periſh like fooles without thinking vpon yet witte muſt haue foreſight thā matter onely periſh euer vvhy ſo mention made men owne kinde certaine haue eie renewment god maketh power ſpirite wee muſt v conſumed better conceyuing heereof let v take helpe ſayd hundred ſecond pſalme intent men ſhould ouerlike themſelues owne ſtate brag luſtineſſe owne prophet giueth v euen sky example although wee ſee ſo hygh maieſty wee bee driuen maze yet notwithſtanding euen thoſe ſelfe ſame sky muſt grow olde chaunged go corruption garment doth ſhall become men muſt needes bee much frayle meane ſeaſon ſaith ſonnes god child ſhall continue wee bee giuen feare god wee ſhall haue firme well ſettled ſtate behold prophet ſeparateth god child common order nature haue ſeede life whereof sainct paule alſo ſpeaketh eyght romanes ſee hee comforteth v foraſmuche loden burthen corruptible weight body wee haue ſayeth hee ſpirite god ſeede true life power ſhall one day bee fully reſtored therefore let v marke well ſuch thinke vpon frailtie ought haue knowen thēſelues nothing nought elſe vanity leaſing ſhall periſh altogither ſo ſeeke remedy whiche god hath offered ſhall bee gathered bondage death renued god hath choſen himſelfe make power flowe downe vpon may drawe water fountayne lyfe vvee ſee ſuche bethinke themſelues preſent life ende thereof cannot conſumed euer bycauſe god remedieth wretched ſtate wherein wee bee borne nature calleth himſelfe haue gather ſentence touched long ſince wit whē haue ſingly perceyued life nothing ſo greatly boote v vvhy ſo make v diſmayde take courage muſt haue eye poynts wit ſee neceſsitie v vntill drawe nere vnto god wee muſt mourne worldling doo beeing drunken theyr pompes pleaſures rich doo wittingly willingly mocke beguile themſelues haue ſayde wee muſt caſt away theſe kinde blindfoldings open eies whē come vnto god haue acknowledged miſerable plight wherin muſt aſſure ſelues god reach hand vnto v bicauſe ſeeketh nothing elſe ſuccour v draw v darkeneſſe wherin nature thus ſee wee haue marke effect immediatly ſayde exceliencie men ſhall taken away ſhall periſhe wiſedome true behoueth v humbled death witte god ſhould bereue v glory wee ſhoulde brought nothing end might know al ſtedfaſtneſſe power proceedeth frō elſe frō free goodueſſe god ſhort liue ſelues bicauſe pleaſeth god haue v come neere vnto ſhould draw fulneſſe according hath giuen v lord ieſus chriſt foūtaine opened vnto v god ſheweth v whervnto leadeth v intent may filled therwith behoueth v brought nothing owne nature yet therwithall know god hath ſtripped v cloth v agayne ſe wherfore paule whē hath ſayd muſt grone ſo lōgas liue world addeth deſire vnclothed wee deſire bee ſtill beholde wherevnto nature driueth v bicauſe knowe another better dwelling place prepared v whē lodging deſtroyed god cloth v immortalitie bring v true ſtate thing wherein differ vnbeleuers frō thoſe haue taſted whit god grace thus ſee ſayd ſentence shall excellency bee taken away ye behold preſent ſtate men cōſider themſelues ye muſt needes conclude brought nothing death haue grace god ſupernaturall ſuccor v ſomuche periſhing periſh whē vnclothed immediatly clothed againe haue ſayde already thus ſee eliphas addeth wiſedome hee intendeth alwayes condemne men bycauſe ſo blockiſhe neuer thinke vpon themſelues thē let v marke great wiſdome prepare ſelues vnto •• ath paſſe cheerfully whē come ſay ſhall haue profited greatly reputed wiſe god ſight whē ſhall haue learned preſent leſſon throughly able put vre receiue fruit yet notwithſtāding ſee euery man ſhunneth melancolike matter ſomuch man ſpeake death euery mā greued falles dump neuertheleſſe cace ſo ſtādeth men ſet mindes vpon muſte needes ouerſhoote thēſelues deuiſes cōſultations greateſt wiſedome weene haue muſt needes turned fooliſhneſſe wherfore greater folly thā man know himſelfe purpoſe ſerue wiſedome diſcretion loke ſelues ſo thinke vpon death ne put thēſeluesin mind ouerſhoote thēſelues much poſsible yea coulde finde harte play wilde colt forgetting themſelues vve ſee al one men ment bury wit reaſon god hath giuen therfore without cauſe eliphas cōdemneth men dying without wiſedome much ſay although god haue told wherevnto muſt come haue ſet butte eies ſhould ſay go thither yet run aſtray life long know whither go cōmeth poynt muſt depart hence grunt grudge ſtriuing fighting againſt god although boote thē ſo yet ſhew furious ſturdineſſe thus thē ſee effect wee haue marke text remayneth ſee cōcluſion eliphas maketh ſayeth iob hath turned al ſides ſhall finde faythfull man ſort cōpany man vtterly forſaken god hereby ſee ſpake men heretofore hee toke owne proper nature wit without hauing reſpect ſpeciall grace whiche god giueth thoſe opening kingdome vnto giuing thē hope ſaluatiō gouerning holy ſpirite making thē go better euerlaſting life eliphas ment ſet mē downe owne proper ſtate plight ſuche bee owne ſelues time ſeparated frō god appeareth ſayth iob thou canſt find ſo much one faythfull mā thy ſort whome thou mayeſt call thy companion vvhy ſo ſayth anger ſleaeth fooles enuie ſpite fretting choler moodineſſe whiche gnaweth man like wilde beaſte thing ſayth killeth witleſſe certeſſe according haue declared already eliphas doth amiſſe applying perſon iob yea doth great wrong yet notwithſtanding doctrine ceaſſeth bee true profitable wit oft wee bee chaſtized god hand wee muſte haue eye thoſe haue gone afore v ſee whether haue ſuffred like torment anguiſh wee ſee god child haue traced path v muſte greeue v ioyned thē howe vve ſee holy father farre excellēter thā men haue indured aduerſitie men god haue ſpared thē ſhould chalenge priuilege thā thē oft ſee god child haue bene beaten diuers rod vexed many miſeries greeſes haue wherwith comfort ourſelues chere vp hart muſt alway haue eye end howe god neuer forſooke pityed come ſuch extremityes muſt alſo hope doas much v marke ſpeciall poynte furthermore wee haue god bee pitifull mercifull vnto v aduerſities let v beware wee frette agaynſt kicke againſte ſpurre wee doo ſhall ſentence bee verified vpon v anger ſleaeth fooles ſayde ſuche chafe grinde teeth againſt affliction ſhew thē ſelue haue profited euill god ſchole ſhall gaine ende ſhall doubling miſerie vvhē ſhall haue fomed rage againſt god whē ſhall haue ſpewed blaſphemies thinke haue wonne prize ala may bee ſo deceyue themſelues much haue ſayde already ſhall doubling miſerie lo howe anger ſleaeth foole moreouer whē haue ſpite others ſtand pleading agaynſt god dealing roughlyer ſuch ſuch elſe doth ſuch maner fretting make pyne thēſelues away ſo ende periſh come vtterly nought behold haue gather vpon text papiſtes farre ouerſotted made ſaying eliphas ſerue turne prooue mē ought pray sainctes departed mē ought flee refuge beholde ſay ſaide iob ſhould haue reſpect ſome one sainctes ſhould ſeeke peraduēture would anſwere much purpoſe ſayd iob went ſeeke dead make interceſsion vntoo god contrarily haue ſhewed heretofore truth matter ſhould finde sainctes bee company ſo sainctes alwayes meeke minde aduerſities god chaſtized ſuch aſort refrained rigour ſo end good happy although time bene ſhaken hande ſuche ſort coulde bee perceyued care yet notwithſtā ding referred thēſelues vnto prayed alwaies vnto aſſuring thēſelues ſhould neuer vtterly forſaken diſappointed ſaluation promiſed lo intent eliphas thē ſee papiſtes falſifyers haue manifeſtly corrupted holye scripture verelye nede borne withal one behalfe meene beaſtlineſſe greate neede wreſte wring holy scripture prooue theyr dreames would make men beleeue ought pray vnto sainctes deceaſſed yet holy scripture cyphereth one word neither mā finde ſo muche one ſillable good proofe proue therefore muſte needes cōfounde white muſt turned blacke meane behoueth v ſhunne mennes inuentions whiche haue beene fooliſhly contriued without god warrant wherefore firſt men wander right way ſaluatiō whē folow owne deuiſes ſecondly cauſeth holy scripture torne peeces ſo men corrupt turne vpſide downe therefore let v learne miſlyke whatſoeuer thing men haue forged owne braine let v holde v ſimplicitie namely muſte couet know ought ſauing god hath declared v owne mouth conclude let v marke well theſe two poyntes haue glaunced alreadie witte often ſcourged god hande let v marke well whither faithful haue gone v haue beene like plight finde god hath excerciſed many tribulation let v cōfort ſelues commeth turne follow let v ſure god forſake v neede forſooke furthermore wee ſee god doth ſcourge v theſe dayes well generally particularly muſt fayne indure many torment trouble let v acknowledge ſelues bee well worthy conſidering greate thankfulneſſe ſeene v whereas hath pleaſed god call v vnto knowledge goſpell haue v yeelde record child howe take profite grace nay contrarywiſe ſeemeth v delight diſanull make vnauayleable god ſerued honoured hand ought bee yee woulde ſay little angelles cōſidering light goſpell god hath giuen vnto v yet wee ſee nothing naughtineſſe hypocriſie moſte parte men vvee good skill make ſome proteſtation oure fayth lettea man examine life hee ſhall finde conformitie goſpell rather ſeemeth haue cōſpired againſt god withdraw ſelues vve ſee haue ſome goodly outwarde ſhew become brutiſh therefore let v ſure god viſiteth v whippes bycauſe ſinnes yet notwithſtāding let v ceaſſe truſt continually call vpon praying burie former faultes guide v ſuch wiſe henceforth may ſerue draw v vnto himſelfe intent may haue pitie vpon v lette v come vnto lowly minde ſo wee haue peece enuie hartburning v whereof mention made heere aſſuring ſelues wee haue ſtyrre vp inflame god vengeance agaynſte v vvhen wee bee come ſuche ſturdineſſe behooueth god alſo ruſhe ſtoutely vpon v ſayde eyghteenth pſalme vvith frowarde thou wilt deale frowardely men needes play wilde beaſtes ſayde god ſtrike ſidelings ouerthwart therfore let v beware fretting chafing ſuch maner repining let v rather acknowledge oure ſelues woorthy hundred thouſande deathes god pityeth v ſuccoureth v infi 〈…〉 goodneſſe wee doe thus let v doubt god performe hee hath promiſed v witte hee hath beaten v howbeit men rod keeping ſuch meaſure ſhall vtterly deſtroyed withdraw hande againe ſhall feele mercifull fauourable lorde ieſus chriſt whome hath ſet foorth rich goodneſſe fatherly loue towardes v let v humble ſelues throne maieſtie beſeeching make v perceyue fault ſuche ſort wee may become owne iudge preuenting iugemēt intent ſo condēned owne ſelues wee may deſire nothing pleaſe reſpects vntill haue bereft v mortall body deliuered v frō bōdage ſin wherein yet ſhut vp take v heauenly kingdom ſo let • ſay almighty god heauenly father c eightenth sermon ſeconde vpon fift chapter 3 haue ſeene foole taking roote immediately haue curſed houſe 4 child ſhall bee farre helpe ſhall bee troden dovvne gate man ſhall deliuer 5 hungry ſhall eate vp harueſt picke midſt thornes thirſtie ſhall drinke vp rich 6 miſerie commeth duſte neyther dooth trouble grovve earth 7 man borne trauell ſparkes flie vpvvarde haue ſeene heretofore win repine againſt god accuſe cruelty paſſe boundes impaciencie▪ wit make cace worſer muſt bee conſumed fretting rage foraſmuche oftentimes deſpyzers god proſper well eaſe mention made ſtate notwithſtanding men eſteeme happy worldward eliphas ſayth hee ſawe fooliſh man proſperitie iudged cōmon trade ſay man happy bliſſed god knew end ſhould euil ſhould puniſhed euē ofſpring although eliphas doo miſapply ſentence vnto iobs perſone yet doctrine god holye ghoſt man god dooth oftentymes vtter ſuche kinde ſayings turne v falſe opinion may cōceyue ſee puniſhed hād runne ſuch exceſſe wickedneſſe rather ſeeming fauoured god know cōmon opinion wee eſteeme thing may ſeene eye minde wadeth god lift vp hand execute iuſtice may ſeene ſcarcely men vouchſafe regarde winke thing tary paciently ſinners wee thinke bee aſleepe hee gouerneth world letteth thing go randon without minde remedy see howe blockiſhe wee bee lord ſheweth v wicked ceaſſe bee curſed euen middes proſperitie wee neede ſpite good fortune terme muſt double puniſhed ſo farre better miſerable bycauſe ſhall pay ouer deere pleaſures beholde effect eliphas ſayeth behold alſo ſayde behoueth v marke well ſentence namely bicauſe cōteyneth verie profitable leſſon wee may better profit ſelues conteyned heere firſte behoueth v note worde foole put ſuche regarde god although worlde take thoſe bee wiſe men whiche skill deale well owne profit ſhift matter cunningly ſay holy ſcripture telleth v none wiſedome feare god haue eye vpon god ſo wee direct lyfe according put whole truſt haue recourſe ſuccour beholde ſame true wiſedome ſee paule ſayth ſuch learned goſpell perfitly wiſe finde order whole lyfe without miſsing erring although thē men full ſuttlety fine conueyance wene themſelues bee verie wiſe yet muſt hold v taught v euerywhit folly vanity ſo long feare god reygneth let v come ſayde haue curſed foole notwithſtanding hee taken roote yea haue curſed houſe immediatly vvhen hee ſpeaketh taking roote expreſſe ſeemed well proſperitie ſhould haue continued firme ſtable eliphas ſayd haue ſeene foole aduaunced aloft great dignitie expreſſed ſo much doth ſayeth planted bicauſe deſpizers god peruerſe froward folke hope haue fortune alwayes ſleeue like tree throughly wel ſattled deeply rooted ground ſtādeth faſt though ſhakē wind ſtormes euē ſo ſeemeth god hath aduaūced wicked ſhal reygne cōtinually triumphes ſhall neuer come end eliphas ſayth ſawe ſuch likelihod hee forbare curſe wicked hand hee ſayth hād immediatly meening taried till came change commonly firſt bluſhe wee ſee deſpizers god bee chiefe ruffe haue winde ſterne terme linger time aſtonied ſaying wil geere proue perceiue thē falling decay thē chaunge minde ſo lōg ſee thē floriſh wote ſay wit end contrariwiſe eliphas telleth v abaſhed whit matter ſpake minde according god vttered comming giue iudgemēt cōdemnatiō hed owne fancie declareth according god ſheweth v wicked ſhall cōfounded end ſo groūded himſelf thervpon ſhaken frō tēptation although ſeene wicked fly ſo high pitch yet hild ſtill one ſtay ſaying muſt needes come naught wee ſee effect cōteyned let v apply leſſon owne vſe wee may knowe howe agreable ſame vnto v true wee haue doe cōdēning mē ſtādeth euery mā hād rather looke vnto himſelfe thing whervnto euery one v muſte apply indeuer thoſe meddle ſo haſtily iudging theyr neyghbors forget themſelues god wil ſpare thē though flatter thēſelues muſt faine come iudge wil handle rigorouſly bicauſe ouerſlipt themſelues ſo much owne fault let v note minde muſte gad heere ſeeke euill neighbour euery man muſt enter himſelfe examine owne ſtate lyfe wee finde fault ſelues muſt condemne furthermore wheras ſaid muſt alſo curſe wicked deſpizers god yeelde ſuch authoritie preheminence v ſelues howe firſte wicked ſorte perſecute trouble v ſo v wrong anoyance wee imagine god hath giuen v ouer hee careth v herevpon tempted conceyue greefe though loſte time walking ſingleneſſe vprightneſſe ſaying howe nowe looke god ſhoulde haue ſuccoured mee neede haue ſerued haue put truſt yet hee ſuffereth mee bee tormented vttermoſt finde releefe whē pray vnto hee make though deafe vve ſee verie troubleſome temptation god ſeemeth make none account ſuccoring v ſuch time men miſsintreate v perſecute v therefore comforte ſlues withall wee muſt practiſe leſſon trouble incomberances thoughe wicked bee theyr tryumphe day ſo ſet foote vpon throte god hath forgotten v ſende v remedie ende let v wayte pacience ſhall finde iſſue bee ſuche god hath promiſed wit regard v mercie nowe ſee profite redoundeth vnto v curſing wicked wit wee ſhall perceyue howe nothing vnhappineſſe theyr eſtate throughout let v proceede yet vvhen wee ſee wicked haue better tyme good men child god wee ſee craftie politike wee ſee triumphe euen ſeeme bee exempted common miſeries earthly lyfe ſay ſee vexed wee woote ſay thinke ſeemeth better gyue ourſelues lewdeneſſe good forſomuche god ſetteth better order matter worlde intent bee prouoked amiſſe wee muſte take concluſion wit deſpiſers god ſeeme bee king prince ſo take theyr pleaſure glory eſtate yet ceaſſe bee curſed true curſedneſſe appeereth firſte daye ſecrete muſte haue leyſure ſhew ſelfe otherſide wee muſte behold thing though cannot ſeene eie yea muſt beholde fayth bycauſe god hath ſpoken alreadie owne mouth muſte ſticke vnto whiche hee ſayeth ſelfe ſame matter ſeuen thirtie pſalme treateth much wee ſee thing ſo confounded mortall life wicked froward ſort haue eaſe well good alſo ſeemeth god minded cocker ſhew fauour reaſon whereof wee may ſee perking vp flouriſhing like ceders mount libanus ſhort deſire commeth effect ſeemeth eye ſtroute heades fatneſſe three ſcore thirtenth pſalme ſayeth vvhat done cace world deemeth ſuch folke bliſſed men clap handes ſides vvee muſt curſe ſay muſt fully reſolued ſelues nothing ſo god hath tolde v ſo hee haue oure eye bleared preſent thing hee haue v aſſure ſelues faith ſhall turne miſchiefe vtter vndooing ſuch ſubmit themſelues vnto concerning word curſe let v marke gyueth v ſcope wiſhe miſchiefe confuſion partie meane deſire vē geance oftentimes wee bee ſo caried away paſſions rayneth nothing v hartburning bitterneſſe leaſtwiſe fooliſh vndiſcrete zeale whereas ſayde eliphas curſed wicked man houſe importeth nothing elſe hilde whiche scripture teacheth ſheweth v therefore v iudges greate raſhneſſe wee ſhould take ſo much preheminence vpon v ſay man ſhall make euill end • ſuch man ſhall come ſhame man muſte preſume ſo farre belongeth god onely curſe bliſſe part wee haue agree hee ſayeth anſwering lord thou art cōpetent iudge worlde doth behoue v herken telleth v obey ſaying without replying contrary without demaunding ſhould poſsible done may gone hand god haue ſpoken word euery one v muſte holde himſelfe contented ſee worde curſe importeth remayneth gather whole ſumme whiche conteyned heere theſe two temptation caſt way ſo cōmon euery v feeleth himſelfe haue neede bee armed againſt ſhal euer daūger miſcarying vnleſſe take hold cōcluſion ſet therfore whenſoeuer wee outrageouſly miſintreated wicked haue v aduantage ſo ſhould ſeeme woulde deuoure v wee haue meanes put v let v make muche ſentence call remembrance ende god ſuffer wicked ruffle continually hee well able redreſſe thing amiſſe thing may bee ſure ſeeing ſheweth v effect experience beholde heere ineſtimable comfort faythfull oppreſſed tormented wrongfully whiche knowe thoſe whiche ſo perſecute curſed god furthermore let v vnderſtande contrary part alſo affliction bliſſed ſay although worlde eſteeme v wretch ſo gazing ſtocke haue fleece eaten back yea alſo troubled tormented yet god ceaſſeth diſpoſe thing ſuche wyſe euill vswarde turned good theyr dealing ſhall welfare beholde child god ought cheere vp themſelues mids ſorrowes wee ſee ſayde pſalme god cutte aſunder cordes wicked drawe plough vpon backe hys church namely intente good men ſhoulde ſtretche handes doo euill commonly thinke thing ſhall continue always broile ſhall neuer better ende thervpon tempted giue ouer ſelues vnto euill man goeth doo v wrong next way ſet v chafe againſt vvee ſee ſuch deſirous walk feare god ſingleneſſe daunger ſtretche theyr handes vnto euill ſay giue themſelues following wicked god ſheweth hee cut aſunder coardes torment v ſo ſhal haue abilitie anoy v hereafter marke ſpeciall poynt furthermore ſee ſuche ſcorne god full gyuen ouer lewdneſſe reſtreyned full ſcope take benefite tyme ſo ladie fortune terme ſeemeth laugh vpon let v ceaſſe curſſe ſay let v paciently wayt ende ſhall aſſure ſeluer proſperitie ſhall turne confuſion intent wee ſhoulde enuie finally let v learne apply vſe haue ſayde therefore god ſuffer v indure muche worlde humble v withall ſo one v ſmitten ſickneſſe pouertie euery man beareth owne croſſe let v thinke god hath forgotten v ſtate woorſe ſo like curſſe wicked proſperitie know nothing elſe dream glydeth awaye ſo alſo contrarie part ſhall ſeeme god hathe ſhaken v worlde iudgeth ſame v oure fleſh owne nature prouoke v ſuch temptation let v aſſure ſelues god turne welfare afflicting v bycauſe wee haue neede bee wounde intangling worlde ſo hee doth duetie phyſition towardes v intending purge v oure naughtie corruption outrageous luſtes fleſhe make v kicke agaynſt maſter like horſes ouerpampered god foreſeeth alſo let v holde certaine ſure wee bee bliſſed worlde ſeeth nothing curſſedneſſe v euen according fleſhe wee perceyue nothing vnhappineſſe euen ſee fayth cannot light otherwiſe vpon feete bicauſe god loueth v ſheweth himſelfe father vvee ſee effect wee haue beare minde let v well aduiſed caſt forth ſuch ſentence curſing againſt fooles v cannot iudge fooles except haue god ſpirite guide v ſuch diſcretion wee may iudge aduenture haue tolde alreadie fooles eliphas ſpeaketh wit thoſe men would take wyſeſt glorie fineneſſe ſuttleneſſe wittes yea ſo much feare liuing god ſo caried away looke euen themſelues ſee reaſon nothing follye vvill yee iudge ſuch men firſt let v haue eye vntoo god ſecondly let euery v enter himſelfe examine himſelfe well true wiſedome therein conſiſteth ſay wee muſt firſt formoſt haue eye vnto god wit ſubmit ſelues wholly vnto ſerue true humilitie frame ſelues vnto worde put whole truſt grace call vpon flee refuge thus ſee point muſt begin minde haue true rule wiſedome afterwarde let v enter owne ſelues vnderſtande owne vice wantes may miſlyke ſelues ſigh ſee keepe way forth godwarde wee ought vvhen haue done ſo may haue good diſcretion iudge fooles although worlde clappe handes wicked yet let v ceaſſe ſet light yea hate abhorre ſayde fiftenth pſalme muſt haue none eſtimation ſuch walke feare god behold ought honourable honoured among v theſe deſpiſers god delight naughtineſſe muſt eſteeme dirt myre wee muſt account doings filth ſo cannot abide ſtinche liue diſhonour god men make reuerence ſooth vp muſt abhorre dogges filthineſſe doth infect whole worlde thus ſee howe wee ought proceede wee may iudge accordingly god therewithall let v alſo practiſe thing ſet downe eliphas ſayth hee hande demed accurſed whome worlde thought haue attayned full meaſure felicitie vvherby ment muſt change opinion according alteration wee ſee worlde perceyue wicked exalted ſo ſeemeth v come naught rather god executeth office al one good euill purpoſe well therefore let v ſo ſwift haſtie iudge according ſucceſſe thing let v conſider worlde neuer ſo troubleſome wee muſt alwayes conclude whatſoeuer god hath declared vnto v ſhall fulfilled ſhort reaſon ſhould meaſure god iudgementes owne fanſie let v hearken ſayth vnto v although firſt daſhe perceyue effect accompliſhment conteyned holy scripture yet let fayth worke behalfe holde v backe let wittes roaue let v ſay seeing ſo thys man deſpizer god leadeth looſe life muſt come euill ende ſo know alreadie miſhap ſheweth ſelfe bicauſe god hath ſayde it▪ muſt ſuffize v moreouer let v learne ſay conteyned eliphas meeneth hard men report beholde ſuch man ſhall bee curſſed hee ſhall vnhappie ſayth truſted god ſhould ſo although ſaw thing confuſed worlde yet notwithſtanding fully perſuaded none bliſſed child god ſuch honoured leaned altogither goodneſſe yea although perſecuted mocked reiected made laughingſtocke ſo ſhoulde ſeeme ſtarke doltes bycauſe iolitie worlde yet ceaſſed bee accepted allowed god hande notwithſtanding worlde deemed contrarie beholde haue remember ſentence euer time required practize leſſon theſe dayes require world full contempt god verely man ſhall ſee wylineſſe ynough folkes wittes ſharpe ſuttle inough theſe dayes man ſhall ſee fewe none regard god number theſe ſmall nay rather men walke ſo raſhly headily ye would ſay religion world ſeeth alſo ſee iniquitie reigneth extremely euen ſuch wiſe moſt part men become ſhameleſſe aſhamed euill vve ſee thing thus confuſed yet whiche eſteeme moſt god fauour euen woorſt ſuch furtheſt ſquare conditionally bee ſuttle ſharpe witted bring matter well full wyles ſhiftes beholde bee wiſe diſcrete men although wicked ſuch eſtimation euery man make muche yet let v holde accurſed bycauſe god oddes cannot ſhewe fauour herewithall let v curſe euill men yea let v hand ſay let v tarie till god lift vp hande worke ſome manifeſt meanes doo verie ſmall honour make account iuſtice ſee execution wicked men brauerie proude good fortune terme let v take ſcorne abhorre let v holde accurſed whatſoeuer come specially ought mark well eliphas addeth child deſpyſe god ſhall fall downe gate ſhall bee ſette farre ſaluation man ſhall ſuccour hee doth v vnderſtande god accompliſh iudgements heere well worke vpon ofſpring ſuch ſhall ſeeme haue eſcaped hande howe may bee ſome ſhall giue themſelues wholly vntoo euill ſo long liue god ſhall ſuffer gather goodes increaſe continually heape vp rich anew euen till dying day yet notwithſtanding bee curſſed rich reuenues curſſed well curſſe perceyued perſon father bicauſe ſhall ſhewe itſelfe child hereby admoniſhed god hath diuers maners executing vengeance therefore let v learne walke feare aduiſedneſſe verily firſt ſight maye ſeeme ſtraunge god ſhoulde puniſhe child father ſakes yet doctrine rife ynough scripture beſides meant ſuch like father god doth well ſhew himſelfe sauiour ſuch borne deſcended euill aunceſters ſee example holy scripture yet falleth moſt commonly iſſue wicked ſort accurſed according alſo god auoucheth hee purſue vengeance third fourth generation vpō thoſe deſpize lift vp themſelues againſt double maner puniſhing wickedneſſe father vpon child ſometymes god ſheweth mercie child yet notwithſtanding ceſſeth chaſtice vnrightuouſneſſe father perſons child example ſee father hath gotten much goodes bee wicked bargayning ſubtiltie craft crueltie yet god haue pitie vpon childe ſuch man ridde quite cleane thoſe euill gotten goodes bicauſe woulde bring confuſion according ſayde ſuch kinde rich wood ende kindle fire god wrath therefore lorde meeneth ſaue childe wicked man hath liued amiſſe hee bereueth hys euill gotten goodes though ſhould let bloud ſaue life might wrapped miſchief corruption father drawne vntoo himſelfe beholde howe god puniſheth wickedneſſe father vppon child yet ceaſſeth bee sauiour child ſhewe mercie sometymes hee paſſeth bicauſe father haue bin ſo farre al ſquare haue led ſtubborne froward life god forſaketh ofſpring inſomuch grace holy ſpirite dwelleth nowe wee bee ſo deſtitute god guiding muſte needes runne intoo deſtruction needes muſte miſchiefe increaſe thus ſee child vngodly doo beare ſinnes father onely god forſaketh leaueth vppe ſtate owne nature alſo hee giueth satan full power ouer letteth haue brydle raigne ſuche houſes owne pleaſure diuill hath ledde away father caryed naughtineſſe child ſhall alſo ouerſhoote themſelues intoo exceſsiue outrage vvee ſee nowe ment heere witte child wicked men deſtitute god grace walke owne inordinate luſtes muſt needes come greater confuſion theyr father thus yee maye ſee ſayde ſhall bee deſtitute helpe ſhall fall downe gate witte bycauſe ſhall fall forreſt among theeues open iuſtice scripture worde cate ſignifieth iudgement bycauſe men caces wont bee debated place common aſſemblies made finally ſeate iuſtice ment pſalme ſayde child good men ſuche bliſſed god ſhall bee mainteyned gate put enemy confuſion likewiſe contrarie part ſayde text child wicked ſhall ſtumble cruſhed peeces yea euen plaine iuſtice vvhereby better expreſſed god perſecuteth openly ſo apparant eye layeth hand vpon addeth immediatly man ſhall ſuccour god myndeth put men ſo deſtruction hee leaueth deſtitute meanes helpe ſuccour deede ſome referre vnto men vnderſtoode howe god hath beſtripped left deſtitute ſuccour intent ſhoulde neuer holpen vp againe partes according whiche haue touched already wee haue ſo much cauſe caſt downe eye pray god make v walke aright obedience although wee perceyue curſe vpon v vpon childrē yet notwithſtanding may take concluſion god hath meanes v incomprehenſible inſomuche ſhall ſeeme vnto v thinges go well wee haue prouided aforehande onely whole lyfe alſo death child alſo may good ſureneſſe welfare ſo may ſeeme wee haue ſet thing good order nothing amiſſe wee may conſider nothing ſoone god doo blowe vpon determination deuiſes hee ſhall turne vpſide downe vvhen wee knowe let v abuſe pacience hee ſpare v time let make v ouerſleepe ſelues ſooth ſelues vice let learne v returne vnto due ſeaſon preuent vengeance wherewith manaceth deſpiſers place herewithall let v marke oftentymes good men child may happen perſecuted vniuſtly neuertheleſſe holy ghoſt preſuppoſeth true alſo may ſticke vnto moſt certaine infallible ſcourging troubling v god hath reſpect prouide v ende hath ſufficiently tried v humbled v turne euill benefite welfare haue ſayde contrarywiſe whereas ſayd race wicked ſhall ſtumble ſet farre helpe expreſſe whē god intendeth puniſh wicked hee proceedeth ſuch ſort men may perceyue hee doth tame might returne vnto mortifie fleſhly affection finally cure like phiſition confounde bring vtter deſtruction behold holy ghoſt preſuppoſeth alſo let v learne diſcerne chaſtizements god vſeth towardes child benefite puniſhments ſendeth vpon wicked amende ſhew himſelfe iudge agaynſt followeth goodes ſuche men ſhall bee deuoured hungrie yea euen picking corne among thornes ſo fieldes ſhall reaped enemy ſhall deuour al ſubſtance alſo men ſhall ſcrape altogither betweene hedge ſo thing hidden bee two three eares corne among buſhes ſhall bee gleaned vp heereby eliphas meeneth god iudgements vpon wicked lyke vnto correction hee ſendeth child ſheweth howe hath vtterly caſt hee pitieth hee haue feele fatherly goodneſſe bycauſe hee acknowledgeth lo effect ſpoken herevpon wee haue nowe call mynde haue declared afore witte wee bee troubled vexed tormented wicked wee muſt paciently abide god leyſure till hee put hande ſuccour v although wee perceyue god iudgementes firſt puſhe yet notwithſtanding let v aſſure ſelues hee execute due time place alſo wee ſee execution let ſame make v ſtande awe ſithe wee ſee vengeance ſo horrible let v brydle ſelues beware wee tempt god sainct paule alſo exhorteth v lette man abuſe ſayeth hee vayne woordes reaſon ſuche thing vengeance god woont come vppon vnbeleeuers ſtubburne perſonnes therefore god doth ſo ſhewe v iudgementes let v quake let v ſtande feare awe ſubmitting ſelues wholly whiche hee ſayeth vttereth hee addeth howbeeit cannot expounded preſent namely becommeth v yeelde ſelues ſuche wyſe god may anſwere bee euer ſayeth vnto v aſſuring ſelues thing fall chaunce worlde long earth ayre heauen men afflicted men beare bane themſelues let v acknowledge happen affliction worlde let v ſure hande god whiche lighteth vpon v ſinnes miſchiefe commeth ſelues
