haue verie welſpring groundworke thereof within v let v ſay acknowledge ende may miſlyke ſelues vice therevpon pray god drawe v himſelfe make grace hath put intoo v auaylable ſaluation mainteyned power hath openly ſhewed towards v name lorde ieſus chriſt may able proſper bliſsing let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele thē ſuch wiſe may returne true repentance ſuffer ſelues gouerned henceforth hande yea ſuch maner holy name may bee glorifyed v whole lyfe ſo let v ſaye almightie god heauenly father c nintenth sermon thirde vpon fift chapter sermon conteyneth yet ſtill expoſition ſixth ſeuenth verſes followeth 8 vvill reaſon vvith god turne talke vnto god 9 doth great vvorkes yea euen vnſercheable vvoorkes vvhich doth vvonderfull deedes vvithout ende 10 vvhich giueth raine vpon earth vvhich maketh vvaters guſhe dovvne ſtreetes began heertoſore tell ment ſaying trouble commeth earth miſerie dust man borne labour wee bee troubled inconuenience wee gaze v ſearch corner wit finde cauſe ſelues yet perceiue god ſcourgeth v ſinnes fountaine aduerſities miſhaps indure muſt ſought owne life warned ſentence wee heare ſpeaking miſeries man life eche one v alſo feeleth part portion therof wit muſt wander abrode fetch long windlaſſes atoneſide atother euery man muſt enter himſelfe ſearche owne ſinnes ſo ſhal find maruell though beſet round ſo many neceſſities life ſubiect ſo wretched ſtate vvhy ſo like wood carieth nature propertie receyueth fire kindleth eaſily ſo alſo ſtandeth cace v haue ſin wood matter affliction wherevpon commeth wrath god ſo muſt nedes cōſumed ſparkles therfore flie aloft ſayth eliphas yet ſecrete operation ſteele ſtriken vpon ſtith certain ſparks would paſſe euen ſo behoueth v vnderſtand fire al miſeries incloſed ſelues ſhal haue profited greatly beare away leſſon although euery one v confeſſe god ſcourgeth v iuſtly yet enter foreſayd conſideration rather labor ſhun much vvhenſoeuer man hath aduerſitie god knocketh doore prouoketh thinke vpon ſinnes man make none accoūt yea rather worſe ſleepeth ſoundly aduerſitie fathereth either vpon thing vpon find ſome caſuall chaunce goeth ſeeke great way neuer entreth intoo examination hys owne life therefore whereas ſubiect ſo many miſeries wantes let v learne take whole burthen blame vppon oure ſelues charge eyther heauen earth example wee ſee weather diſtempered ſo commeth froſt thunder haile let v aſſure ſelues aire ſo diſpoſed ſelfe come drought heauen ſo hardened owne nature earth barrein proceedeth owne kind ſelues cauſe therfore ſayd borne vnto eliphas preſuppoſeth foraſmuch borne euill wholy inclined ouermany vice meete ſhould bee handled therafter god ſhould anſwere v according come vnto verily bring al corruption v mother wombe ſo naturally giuen naughtineſſe ſinne therefore muſte ſtate ſutable therevnto ſay foraſmuch god findeth v ſuch muſt alſo ſend v knoweth bee conuenient iuſt rightfull v ſo eliphas meeneth god created v purpoſe deale ſo hardly v taketh man corrupt nature euer ſince turned away god ſaith requiſit eſtate ſhuld ſuch bicauſe able conceiue god ſpreadeth goodneſſe vpon v intreateth v gently wee obedient vnto poynts foraſmuch men neuer humble themſelues except bee conſtrained therto force indeuer ſtriue againſt god eliphas addeth another ſentence wit turneth himſelfe vnto god purpoſeth reaſon ſhould ſay men cannot abide receiue doctrine namely ſhoulde bee tolde well worthie bee ſcourged therefore muſt ſtriue agaynſt take al good worth blame creaturs miſeries indure rather acknowledge thēſelues cauſe therof men thē cannot ſtoupe cōceiue true except made ſtoupe ſhewing thē maieſtie god therfore vntil haue ſinnes layd afore v bee made perceyue howe god whome wee haue deale man whiche holde himſelfe aloofe hath anſwers readie tongs end ſetteth ſome color vpō miſdoings though altogither rebellious yet notwithſtāding wil ſuch careleſneſſe v whatſoeuer mē ſayto v al one wee neyther greeued moued vice vvhat muſt vve ſhal neuer lerne true humilitie vntil made vnderſtand god whō muſt anſwere cited appere throne feele iugde moreouer alſo cannot eſcape hande life muſt knowne examined vvhen brought poynt muſt faine looke vnto god begin ſort rouze vp ſelues ſo ſo careleſſe drouſie loftineſſe fond ouerweening ſooth flatter ourſelues withall come haue ſome feeling perceyuing miſeries aboue god maieſtie ſet oure eye make v feele howe dreadfull greatneſſe ſette afore v maketh v tremble yet vve ſee ſporting matter heere ſleeping v bearing oure ſelues hande vvherfore roome flattery god conſuming fire appeareth maketh v come nere vnto ſo wee perceyue howe hee maketh mountaynes melt able make cleane riddance thing therefore know greatneſſe god needes muſt ſinke vnder forget pride thus much concerning intent eliphas nowe muſt conſider doctrine applie ſelues firſt al oft feel ſelues ſufficiētly wakened condemne ſelues ſinnes let v vſe order ſet downe v haue eye vnto god vvee may ſee ſome man ſufficiently conuinced ſinnes notwithſtanding goeth ſtill followeth owne ſwinge reproued elſe otherwiſe feele remorſe owne conſcience paſſeth ouer taketh great greefe ſo bycauſe hee hath eye vpon god thus yee ſee maketh v continue ſinnes yee ſee cauſe wee bee caſt downe true humilitie namely bycauſe perceyue god iudge hee wyth haue none remedie haue ſpoken wit firſt wee bee wakened oute ſinnes otherwiſe wee neuer thinke bee ſorie much may fall diuell ſhall ſo bewitch v bee conſtrayned perceyue goeth well v ſhall become amazed wee muſt come ſeconde poynt ſay ala poore creature art thou able ſcape vengeance thy god vvhen worlde hath magnified thee yet ſhalt thou miſſe condemned ſame al creature perceiue thy ſhame thou muſt bee brought ſhame little babe euen vnto beaſtes thou canſt ſhift thy hand ſhall become thee thou muſt bee faine come heauenly iudge thinkeſt thou hath dreadfull iudgement damnation againſt thee ſeing thou continueſt ſo naughtineſſe thus ſee wee meane waken ſelues oure ſinnes diſpleaſe v ynough wee feele ſo liuely earneſt ſorineſſe requiſite thus ſee muſt reaſon god men imagine ſelues haue better ende ſtaffe ſo long abide heere belowe trauell alwayes end according fleſh nature ouer much giuen way man bee rebuked beſtyrres ſpake ſayth haſt thou thou looke well vpon thy ſelfe thou ſhalt finde bee blamed home thou art haſtie vpon mee thou ſeemeſt thoughe thou wouldeſt quarell mee ſeemeth thou wouldeſt deface beholde ſnap men rebuke v yea wee doo muche god ſpecially man accuſe v wee ſticke ſeeke ſtill ſuche ſtartinghole howe vvhen man conſidereth himſelfe hee perceyueth well god puniſhe hee dealeth rightly ſtart examining neighbour hee ſaye himſelfe ſuch one woorſe leaſt wyſe badde hath ſuche one deſerued greate puniſhment thus wee ſee howe wee labour alwayes iuſtifie oure cace fleeing god therfore behoueth v marke wel leſſon muſt reaſon men ſay muſt ſtay wee ſhall gaine nothing ſo muſt rather call home wit aduiſedly ſay ala ſee well god ſcourgeth mee therefore behoueth heedfull conſider hande therevpon prepare ſelfe humilitie haueſayde alreadie furthermore whereas ſayde ſhall bee better touched thinking vpon god meaning muſt know god bee ſuche one ſo long men beare themſelues hande diſguiſe god falſe imagination bending ſome reede dalying little babe yea worſe greater libertie vſed god little babe proceedeth outrage conſider greatneſſe therefore muſt ſo ſurmyze god preſume diſguiſe make ſuche one fanſie luſt away muſt know bee ſuch one ſheweth himſelfe worde muſt alſo conceiue ſuche ſort hee vttereth himſelfe workes vvhen haue well bethought v certaine prattling well ſtinted wee bee ſo pert ſo raſh come pleade agaynſt beare ſelues hande hee tormenteth v without cauſe wee haue deſerued maner ſelf flatterings muſt thruſt downe hypocriſie muſt done away muſt abaſhed diſmayd ſaid greatneſſe maieſtie ſhal haue conceyued god thus ſee ſeconde poynt well worthie bee noted ought knowe god truly faynedly ſee saint paule ſayeth men vaniſhed away imagination namely bicauſe tranſformed god inaſmuch robbed god glorie god alſo put ſhame ſo hee gaue vp lewd minde reaſon whereof gaue themſelues ouer villanie ſhameful doings caſt themſelues ſuch diſhoneſtie man might aſhamed filthineſſe ſo ſayth glorified god wrongfully deface maieſtie turned ſo truth lie tranſformed wiſe seing thē maladie ouercōmon euery man hath experience himſelfe therefore ſtandeth v hande marke well doctrine wit thinke god muſt bee done reuerence knowe falſly ſurmyze bee true god ſheweth himſelfe v word yet neuertheleſſe vnexcuſable cō ſider workes alſo inaſmuch hath left himſelfe without witneſſe ſayth paule xiiij actes hee ſpeaketh order nature glaſſe v behold god paule ſayth expreſly god maketh sunne ſhine ſendeth rayne ſendeth diuerſitie ſeaſons hee maketh earth yelde frute herein leaueth himſelfe without good recorde one ſhould pleade cace ſay vvhereas men haue knowne glory maieſtie perceyued haue thing hand gouerne thing haue created reaſon ſhould alledge ignorance verie order nature might haue perceyued one creator whiche diſpoſeth let v open eye wee ſhall haue proofes ynowe ſhewe v greatneſſe god end may learne honor deſerueth thus ſee eliphas doth leſſon turne greatly profit practiſe throughly ſhort let v beare minde oft communication concerning god moued vntoo v thinke haue worde let v marke properly belonging vnto god cannot ſeparated ende may magnifie worthie vvere well ſetled v ſhould ſo much giuē ſuperſtition neither ſhould ſo worldly two vice reigne haue alwayes reigned world one contempt god men care trample vnder feete much lieth true able impeach maieſtie neuertheleſſe ſuch diueliſh pride ſeene men ſteade worſhipping god ſubmitting themſelues vnto could finde heart throwe vnder foote triumph ouer ſuffer haue kind authoritie ouer thus ſee maladie ouer great outrageous yet hath beene tymes ſaye menne ſo ouerheatheniſh knowe reuerence whiche owe vntoo god othervice ſuperſtition whiche vnder ſhadowe deuotion menne gad ſeeke fooliſhe inuentions whereof commeth thys miſchiefe euen bycauſe god knowne rightly properly belonging vnto wel vnderſtoode mightineſſe iuſtice goodneſſe certaine men woulde caryed ſo away men forge themſelues vndergoddes ſay forge idolles owne heades aſſigne office though woulde deale vertues pertayne vntoo god alone though woulde put ſpoyle euery one haue ſhare bootie nowe ye ſee ſayde muſt ſo much diligent knowe god aright namely ende hee bee robbed honour man bereue owne reſteth onely howe may doo haue alreadie brieflye tolde howe neede onely open theyr eye god vttereth himſelfe ſuche ſort order nature wee vtterly vnexcuſable wee yeelde whiche eliphas ſheweth heere hee beginneth ſay god woorkes great vnable bee ſearched hee doth wonderfull decdes without number eliphas taketh generall ſentence afterwarde ſpeciſyeth thing particular example whiche hee ſpoken ſumme therefore preface ſhould one worde foreſhew hee ment ſay wiſe god doth exceeding great incomprehenſible thing doings wonderfull without ende vvhen vnderſtand god workes exceeding great incomprehenſible ſhall forced lift vp mindes perceyue wee muſt diſguiſe ſurmize thing naturall reaſon muſt mount vp higher certaine ledde thervnto whether thus wee ſee eliphaſsis meaning vvhen men looke vnto godwarde touched ſuche feare ſuch humilitie requiſite vvhat reaſon bycauſe thinke workes god workes come diſcourſe euery man think himſelfe competent iudge ſpeake verdite vpon yea wee bee bolde ynough rather ouerbolde controll god woorke faſhion wee bee full grudging wee ſay wherefore hee went ſuch matter ſo vvhat cauſe ſuche ouerboldneſſe men ſo ſaucie god holde plea agaynſt ſpecially make themſelues iudges bycauſe haue conſidered great incomprehenſible workes workes god incomprehenſible haue wee meaſure great ynough declare vvhat witte vvhen wee haue ſtretched vttermoſt length breadth may able comprehende hundreth part god woorkes determination whiche ſo highe hidden v vve muſt go ſelues wee minde onely taſte wonderfull infinite wiſedome appeareth god workes nowe muſt mount aboue owne wittes get little taſte ſhall become v wee incloze wee knowe vttermoſt pray wee attaine therevntoo vve ſee men worſe mad ſo preſumptuous deſyre determine god workes imcomprehenſible true cannot gage bottome god workes comprehende reaſon yet god keepeth good way giue v ſuch knowledge knoweth bee behoofe ſo note god workes incomprehenſible themſelues ſay wil ſearch euer parcelmeale ſhall neuer able atteyne depth therefore wee muſt bee whelmed vnder ſayde greatneſſe aſſuring ſelues take vpon v bee iudges god workes ſhall find wherwith ſtoppe eies bycauſe cannot atteyne ſecrets furthermore wee ſhall haue proceeded ſuche humilitie knowing wee bee competent iudges knowe thing high deepe v let v pray god giue v ſpirite wiſedome wee may iudge aright hys woorkes hee graunt v grace perceyue ſo much behoofe wee may diſcouer decypher ſo nothing ſhoulde bee vnknowne v ſhoulde fall oute oure imagination god holde v ſhort ſo ſhall knowe part meane ſeaſon ſayde knowledge muſt ſuffyze v muche nothing ſhall bee hidden v good conuenient welfare therefore let v contente ſelues herewith otherwiſe vnthankefulneſſe v bee deſirous enter ſo intoo god ſecretes reade therein wee woulde haue thing eſcape v ſo fond curious haue deſire make ſubiect fond braine thus ſee two poyntes wee haue marke heere infinite wiſedome thoſe workes god ſmalleſt baſeſt greateſt ſort ſuch ſurmount capacitie specially cace concerneth redemption concerneth god ſealing vp recorde adoption v hys holy spirite matter ſurmounteth common order nature chiefly ſayd hath chozen v worlde made hee hath chozen v generall ſo many hee thought good hee hath forſaken reſt • wee ſee ſecretes highe v vvhat done let v aſſure ſelues tootoo vnexcuſable behalfe walk feare wareneſſe conſidering theſe thing incomprehenſible thinke attaine ſo high deſire ſtye vp maner aboue skyes hauing wing make v breake neckes moreouer haue giuen glory vnto god confeſſed onely mouth alſo deede workes incomprehenſible bottomleſſe pitte ſwallow vp vnderſtanding let v ceaſſe pray make v perceyuc ſo farre foorth knoweth meete capacitie therewithall let v alſo ſearche ſhewed v holy scripture god haue v negligent v ſay papiſtes wee muſte bee inquiſitiue god ſecretes holy scripture giuen v god euery man ſhoulde ſeeke yet therewithall wyll alſo men ſhoulde holde waye hee ſheweth wit ſhould al humilitie follow conteyned holy ſcripture nowe wee haue learned god teacheth v ſchole let v hold v come toy head contrarie ſo hart tickled ſeeke meete v know let v beware haue wiſdome modeſty ſay poore creature meete thou ſhouldeſt preſume haue larger inſtruction thā god giues thee holy ſcripture let v wey well ſaying end may hold ſelues ſuch ſobrietie iudge raſhly god workes ſayd god doth wonderfull deedes without end vvhereas god wor • called wonderful ſecret ſo worde importeth bring v reuerencing thē god meening knowing ſuch greatneſſe work ſhoulde aſtoniſh v driue v contrarywiſe draw v ſuch reuerence ſhoulde honor ſaying lorde howe mightie art thou lorde howe great thy power thy goodneſſe thy iuſtice thy wiſdome vndoubtedly dauid knew wel infinit greatneſſe god workes yet notwithſtanding hee ceaſſeth ſay lorde thy work full wiſdome rightuouſneſſe knew well haue conſider god work yet hee honoured neuertheleſſe let v learne conceyue ſuche greatneſſe god workes might make v dull lyke brute beaſtes ſo ſhould knowe become take inſtruction good learning ſo conceyue ſame may ſerue repreſſe v wit ouerwandring wee play horſes broken looſe ſo take libertie haue tolde ſay know cōmeth paſſe ſo let v modeſt true wiſedome ignorant thing god haue hidden frō v thus ſee muſt prepare ſelues lowlineſſe modeſtie furthermore let v vnderſtand ther withall muſt reuerence workes god howe comprehende infinite wiſedome rightuouſneſſe power conteyned thē according ſmal capacitie aſſuring ſelues god doth thing without reaſon although ſame knowne vnto v firſt daſh god doth alwayes vtter preſent reaſon workes ſo mē may perceiue thē againe ſayd wiſdome ſo deepe named bottomleſſe pit therefore let v learne reuerēce god work although perceiue euermore cauſe hee worketh ſo vvee ſee well wiſe god workes wonderfull hee ſayth expreſſely haue none ende vvhereby men yet better humbled wee chaunce come full vnderſtanding ſome one thing ſeemeth v nothing go beyonde v ſo cunning queſtions whiche propounded vnto v ſhall bee aſſoiled hand put cace able iudge god workes two three hundred vvhat right nought ſo without number haue ſayd alreadie leaſt god workes ynough ouerwhelme v ſhall become v whē come ſayd bottomleſſe depth whereof none ende lo howe behoueth v wey well ſpoken heere generally way preface make v enter better conſideration god workes wont may yeeld honor vnto maieſtie due haue touched heeretofore eliphas hath ſpoken ſo generall ſpeaketh particularly alſo ſaying god giueth raine vpon earth maketh water guſh downe ſtreetes ſeemeth bee nothing purpoſe matter hand men may perceiue thēſelues rightly puniſhed god handle thē wil muſt ſtand pleading againſt ſhall gaine nothing ſo muſt neceſsitie ouercome thē mention made rayne ſhould ſeeme bymatter muſt marke bee put mynde cōmon order god kepeth gouerniug creature end ſhould apply al wholy owne vſe haue run vp downe trauerſed frō one ſide another muſt enter ſelues muſt waken vp wit muſt apply doctrine ſuch vſe haue ſpoken may honour god deſerueth thus ye ſee mention made raine doubt vnder one particular eliphas cōprehendeth ſhould ſay vve onely ſee god hath created thing ſuch workmanſhip sky earth al think vpon muſt needes aſtonied alſo ſee howe guideth diſpoſeth thing giueth raine winde ſendeth cōtrarie alſo liſteth thus much cō cerning ſaying eliphas furthermore let v marke ynough yeelde vnto god honor ſoueraintie diſpoſe creature owne pleaſure muſt alſo conſider ende wherefore▪ vvhich ſhuld lern therby ſubmit ſelues vnto acknowlege father maſter see whereat holy scripture amed fayle therof two poynts firſt formoſt regarde god whether raine whether make fayre weather ſhet eye true wee bee glad rayne come may ſerue turne meane paſſe knowe god ſending mind ſo tyed earth cannot mount vp thither alſo wee haue faire weather ſo ſee ſunne glad ſhining yet notwithſtāding cōſider god hath kindled ſuch creſſet giue v light thus haue regarde god whiche verye great ouer beaſtly vice let v put cace god come thought yet many ſhould ſay god bee prayſed faire weather meane forget neuer remēber ſay god giueth v faire weather ſhewe himſelfe father towardes v therfore becōmeth v like minded vnto behaue ſelues true child therwithall bethinke ourſelues thus behold god creature obey yet obedience hath hād vndoubtedly beholde order nature muſt lead v certen fear god preſent taſting goodneſſe end may giuē vp vnto wholly dedicated obedience lo maner muſt practize ſayde leſſon eliphas ſheweth v heere witte god ſendeth rayne maketh water runne guſhing thorough ſtreetes vve ſee alſo maner holy ſcripture ſpeketh therof haue tolde already good wiſdome know end intēt holy▪ ghoſt ſetteth theſe thing vnto v thereby may lerne feare honor god know maner authoritie wee graunt vnto maner ſoueraintie hath ouer v therevpon come iuſtice alſo humble ſelues vnder ſame true eliphas misbehaueth himſelfe applying thing perſon iob neuertheleſſe haue ſaid heretofore doctrine good holy ghoſt muſt receiue doctrine mortal mā muſt ſay ſpirit god ſpake therefore remaineth v haue ſaid wiſdome diſcretion knowing profite ſelues time place ſhewed v heere let v like eliphas wreſteth thing perſon iob haue receyued generall doctrine confeſſed ſame true let euery one v arme himſelfe accordingly ſee effect ſhewed v heere wit inconueniences wherevnto life ſubiect muſt fathered vpon ſinnes wee muſte blame neither heauen earth creature proſper wee woulde wiſhe euery one v muſt condemne himſelfe conſider howe haue wood within v fewell kindleth fire god wrath forſomuche wee bee giuen euill euen byrth muſt maruell though wee bee ſubiect ſo many miſeries neceſsities troubled dyuers maners let v blame god let v haue eie welſpring wit ſinnes cauſe inconueniences wee endure world let v take heede therefore plead agaynſt haue bin wont rather let v yeelde ſelues giltie let v knowe rightuous puniſhing v intēt may learne feare honor humbleneſſe becommeth v thus ye ſee haue remember vpō text wayting till reſidue may layde foorth fully nowe let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god acknowledgement offence beſeeching make v knowe better haue done aboue thing holde v ſuch awe vnder maieſtie wee maye bee touched quicke bee ſo dull wee haue beene heretofore may knowe maner wee ought iudge workes therewithall haue eye according hee ſheweth vntoo v worde intent wee humbling oure ſelues vnder greatneſſe maieſtie maye deſyre nothing glorifie name poynts onely mouth alſo verye deede ſhewe hee well worthie reigne ouer v thing great ſmall ought humble themſelues vnto honour may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c twentith sermon fourth vpon fifth chapter 11 exalt deſpyſed bring ſafetie vvhich vexed heart 12 hee diſappoynteth thoughtes vvicked ſuch vviſe handes thing enterpriſe 13 hee ouertaketh vviſe ovvne vvilyneſſe diſappoynteth determination craftie 14 noonetyde vvalke darkeneſſe grope the▪ rode day light night 15 plucketh avvay oppreſſed ſvvord mouth hand ſtrong 16 hope heereafter oppreſſed mouthe vvickedneſſe ſhall ſtopped ſayde heere god exalteth ſuche despiſed ſentence well worthy bee borne minde heereby warned repayre vnto wee ſee ſelues ſo oppreſſed proude ſeemeth ſhall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed ſpecially foraſmuche ſayde god plucketh backe ſafetie vexed hart wee bee ſo tormented aduerſities wee extreme anguiſhe let v learne call vpon god ſith chalengeth office ſaue thoſe ſuch diſtreſſe able indure true god giue ſeruaunts ſuch proſperitie ſhall neuer diſquieted hath rightfull reaſon moue doe wee ſee pryde man nature although appeare fully yet ſeede hidden god therefore muſt remedie meane thereof tame v affliction surely wee ſhall ſee diuers ſuffer many aduerſities yet bee neuer humbled like reſtie iade ſuffer himſelfe bee beaten bellye bee ripte rather hee obey ſo ſtubborne vttermoſt pleaſeth god tame men maketh affliction bee force whiche hee ſendeth ſo ſerue medicine purge ſayde pryde preſumptuouſneſſe whereout could otherwiſe drawe themſelues vvee ſee howe without cauſe god dothe ſo exerciſe child euen ſuffer bee deſpized worldwarde bee ſcorned bee quite cleane without authoritie credite bee ſhorte ſeeme bee vtterly forſaken vvhy doth hee ſo bycauſe haue neede bee ſuch aſchole vvherefore ſendeth hee ſo many aduerſities fayne ſighe grone wote whiche ſide turne make call vpon flee vnto refuge vvee ſee howe theſe affliction wee bee taught firſt knowe ourſelues preſume thing ſelues bee puffed vp pryde ſtatelyneſſe ſecondly take muche pleaſure oure owne luſtes rather forſake worldly thinges finally call vpon god whiche principalleſt pointe long men bee eaſe although dare ſay goe beyond god yet doings ſhewe themſelues ſo ſotted haue minde call vpon god commende ſelues vnto yee ſee god ſuffreth ſeruauntes bee afflicted ſuche wiſe yea euen bee pinched anguiſhe hearte wote become therefore let v beare doctrine well mynde conſidering • hat ſo muche profite furthermore aboue let v aduiſe oure ſelues practize oure neede vvhenſoeuer wee ſhall bee oppreſſed men ſhall ſeeme wee muſt needes periſhe ſeeing declared heere howe god office lifte vppe ſo oppreſſed recomforte ſo ſorrowe let v doubte hee performe promiſe hee hath forgotten nature wee ſhal certeinely finde hee ſhewe himſelfe bee ſame hee beginning heere wee ſee alſo wherefore hee abaceth ſuche aduaunced ſome dignitie honour vvhen ſome man beholdeth ſuche backtumblings thinkes bee wheele fortune wicked ſorte grudge god ſhoulde play ſo men ball happeneth reaſon vnthankfulneſſe ſuche hyghe eſtate forget whence welfare commeth therevpon bee ſo ſotted greatneſſe wexe ſtoute againſte god dyuers wayes fall outrage therefore god fayne abate ſuche manner pryde ſo wee ſee cauſe maketh god pull downe thoſe whome hee exalted afore namely ſay bycauſe keepe themſelues within boundes modeſtie giue glorie vnto god know themſelues contrariwyſe honour god hathe doone vnto forget themſelues aduaunce themſelues without meaſure therefore god fayne ſhewe howe • bey bee nothing doe beguyle ſelues pryde therefore let aduaunced hyghe eſtate beware walke feare god carefulneſſe moreouer ſuche bace deſpyzed haue inough wherewith comforte themſelues haue ſayde haue promiſe belongeth god giue helpe ſuche diſtreſſe lo wee haue marke although bee done alwayes apparantly eye yet notwithſtanding ſuche ſorrowfull heart aright ſaye whiche ſo caſte downe flee vnto god ſeeke reliefe hande ſhall feele operation doctrine certeſſe v generall doe finde experience god lifteth vp deſpyzed wee nature plight dothe god finde v hee adopteth v bee child wee plunged filthyneſſe infection onely ſo alſo fayne drawe v gulfe hell reaſon whereof may well bee ſayde doubtleſſe nature wee bee curſed caytifes bring nothing v image deathe nothing v ſinne ſpecially ſayde ezechiell wee bee lyke chylde newely come wombe mother yea euen mother full corruption inſomuche beſides myſeries wherein hee wrapped hath alſo maner filthineſſe gore bloud maner vncleanneſſe prophete ſpeaketh vvee ſee ſtate till god haue made v cleane ſo ſeeing euerie one v alreadie knoweth ſelfe owne behalfe howe god hath exalted v calling v hope kingdome heauen eternall lyfe yea hath plucked v euen bottomleſſe pit death clenzed v ſo ſtinking filthineſſe haue wee cauſe hope like heereafter therefore aboue thing wee bee ſuche diſtreſſe wee beare let v put vp ſute vnto maye pleaſe ſuccour v haue pitie v vvee ſee howe god regardeth ſuche bee ofcaſtes worlde ende ſuccour followeth immediatly hee breaketh determination wicked ende handes ſhoulde accomplyſhe anye enterpriſes vvee ſee yet one comfort whiche behoueth v marke well wee may bee pacient world notwithſtanding enemy aſſayle v ſides true god ſpareth v ſometimes hee ſheweth open warre againſte v wicked haue alwayrs power perſecute v otherwiſe letted elſe god dothe ſorte brydle rage ſo muche wee haue alwayes open warre yet impoſsible god child ſhould liue world bee many peril continually ſo muſt walke ſimplicitie true ought bee wiſe lord hath giuen ſo muche wiſedome requiſitc howe ſo euer worlde goe muſt maynteine ſelues crafte wylineſſe wicked practizes althoughe bee among wolues yet muſt bee lambes ſheepe although bee among fox yet muſt continue doues muſte keepe ſtill ſame ſimplicitie whiche god commaundeth vvee ſee howe worlde fraught naughtineſſe ſo muche yee fynde right honeſt man ſaye verie fyne ſeede rare bee met withall nowe god ſhoulde worke diſappointe purpoſes wicked ſhoulde become v ſhould wee periſhe hundreth time adaye wee ſee heere texte whereof wee muſte make owne profite god watcheth heauen diſappointe enterprizes practizes whiche wicked ſorte doe contriue againſte v firſte formoſte bee temptation v wee ſee oure ſelues watched wayted vpon nothing elſe ſought catche v auauntage winde aboute v ſaye bee tempting v doe like ſaye ſelues haue doe ſuttle foxe therefore muſte bee faine keepe good watche howe wit againſt wylye double wyly ſay prouerbe beholde howe wee bee giuen decline vnto euill make two diuels one prouerbe ſayeth wee bee ſo aſſayled naughtineſſe men waye holde v obedience vnto god make v walke ſimplicitie ſoundneſſe acknowledging god bee oure buckler hee prouide well inough miſcheeues prepared againſt v true wee ought defende oure ſelues yea verily ſo farre ſorth god giueth leaue witte ſo wee ſteppe aſide vprightneſſe hee commaundeth howe ſo euer caſe ſtandeth wee vſe guile practize anye thing vnlawfull v doe vvhen wee proceede manner lette v aſſure oure ſelues god well inough finde meanes diſpatche enterpriſes ſuche thinke catche v pitfall craftineſſe god prouide ſuche wiſe knoweth bee profitable v furthemore nothing ſpoken heere wee finde daily experience child god bee anye time deceyued knowe god hilde vnder protection ſaue ſnares ginnes ſuche ſeeke nothing wynde aboute ſhould bee ouertaken euery blowe ſome ſmall thing alſo whole life ſee well inough ſeeing wee haue ſuche proofe doctrine ought better confirmed thereby howe vvhen man hath eye ſelfe wee haue skill inough ſay nothing naughtineſſe worlde ſo man tell whome may truſt whiche ſide ſo euer man turneth himſelfe hee daunger deceiued come ſuch confuſion faithe truſtineſſe nother kinſfolke friendes vvell ſith euerye man maketh ſuche complaint wee bee beguiled let v marke well god defendeth v likely wee ſhould bee beguiled euerie blowe would become v god ſhould remedie therefore let euery man acknowledge preſerued hand god without cauſe god hath auouched office make deuiſes wicked vaniſh away ende ſhould execute attemptes true although god giueth wicked men ſtrength execute deuices yet hee well able preuent practizes ouerthrowe euerychone hee ſayth anone hee ouertaketh wyſe owne wylyneſſe sometimes god blyndeth weene ſelues bee verye ſuttle cunning ſo hee maketh bee naked lo heere one waye whiche hee hath ſaue thoſe albeit hee let wicked men runne vpon brydle albeit haue manye deuiſes albeit ſeeme impoſsible wee ſhould meanes eſcape handes yet notwythſtanding euen god ſhall haue gyuen ſuche libertie manne ſhall ſee ende geere ſhall vaniſhe awaye bee euen pointe ſet practizes abroche ſaye wee ſee wee haue doe yee ſee howe wee muſte proceede euen deuiſes ſhall waſhe away therefore ſhall haue ſet thinges readineſſe ſhall haue concluded vppon matter ſo likelyhoode deuiſes ſhall come effecte god mocke man woulde wonder ſee howe thinges ſhall fall cleane contrarie whiche imagined true ſhall perceiue howe doone intent ſhould knowe howe god worketh wonderfull faſhion therefore gracious goodneſſe muſte needes appeere better thereby towardes v let v marke well ſayde heere effecte namely god ſuffreth wicked haue ſtore wile ſuttle deuiſes ſo maye ſeeme ſhall vtterly ouerthrowe whole church elſe go oppreſſe ſome one man two three likely meanes bee reſiſted vvhat bee doone cace vvee muſt flee god ſay well lord true ſee enemy haue ſtore guyles matter come incountering ſuttle ſhiftes pollicies wee ſhall bee farre ouermatched vtterly vndoone commeth thy turne daſhe al deuiſes make flee awaye ayre ſo maye haue power hande put execution beholde howe wee muſte haue recourſe vnto god ſticke promiſes whiche hee hath made v heere therefore god ſhall haue ſuffred wicked ſorte debate liſte myndes vndertake able holde handes tyed welinough maye bee hee giue leaue raunge farre inoughe yet therewithall commeth poynte accompliſhing thing whiche debated ſhall bee diſappoynted handes ſhall bee tyed beleeue haue thinges commaundemente ſhall bee deſtitute counſell aduiſement yea force power ſo muche god hath prouided matter incomprehenſible maner thus muche concerning ſtrayne eliphas proceedeth yet ſaying god ouertaketh wyſe theyr owne wylyneſſe determination wycked defeated yea euen ſuche wyſe ſtumble open lyghte darke grope aboute noone dayes nyghte heere eliphas onely declareth god ſuffer wicked accomplyſhe whiche conceyued heartes alſo addeth god ouertaketh owne wyles ſuche wyſe ouerthwarteth deuiſes bee berefte wittes wote doe little babe ſo practizes become altogither laughingſtockes wee muſte marke well theſe two thinges haue ſayde heeretofore wee ſee god diſappoynte oure enemy pollicies oure ſide wee haue greate aduice ſo lykelyhoode wee ſhall miſſe bee oppreſſed yee ſhall ſee v ouertaken diſpayre bycauſe oure ſeeming god meant ayde v hee woulde put forthe himſelfe make ſo long tarying therefore hee make delay aſtonied afraide meete wee ſhould pacient though god reſiſt wicked confederate themſelues ſuche wiſe againſte v rather giueth leaue debate vpon matter wherefore hee come due time deliuer v handes notwithſtanding beleeue certeinly bring attemptes aboute oure vtter ouerthrowe yet neuertheleſſe ſometymes god tarrieth ſo long pittieth ou • e feebleneſſe hee ſeeth v daunger bee ſhaken preuenteth matter maketh haſt ſuccour v howe beholde oure enemy ouerſuttle polytike moreouer bee ſo practyzed man woulde ſuppoſe ſuttle ſhiftes whole worlde hadde paſſed throughe handes good cauſe haue wee bee afrayde wee ſee haue made tryall ſuche manner pollycies god able ſotte ſuche ſorte ſhall become beaſtes whereas thought haue bene handeſome men coulde bee become like little babe ſo muche wonder ſee conſulte thinges wherein neyther ryme reaſon ſay howe commeth paſſe god well skill howe ſende ſpirite drunkenneſſe ſo ſhall ſtagger reele without drinking anye drop wyne according hee declareth prophetes lyke hee gyuer witte diſcretion ſuche filie idiotes ſo contrariwyſe hee knoweth howe blynde vnderſtanding ſuche thinke ſelues ſee farre afore ſo muche euen hyghe noonetide doe nothing grope lyke poore ſilye blinde ſoules vve ſee eliphas ment ſhewe heere doctrine extendeth ſelfe verye farre thereby taught ſee enemy practize poſsible againſte v wee may ſet light aſſuring ourſelues oure god make attemptes vayne according wee ſee howe prophete eſaye ſpeaketh two ſentences goe youre waye ſayeth hee take counſell togyther yet ſhall come nothing lorde diſappoynt euerywhit go way ſayth make great deliberation gather ſelues togyther yet muſte diſappointed ſo god holdeth counſell heauen make naughtineſſe ſuttleties bee turned backe yee ſhall winne nothing againſte beholde alſo gret force prepared againſt citie hieruſalem poore king ezechias come vtter extremitie ſo much made countenaunce withſtande enemie ſawe himſelfe vnable match mynded purchaſe peace money therevpon ſpoyled himſelfe ſubſtance contented temple god ſhould fleeced ſo left value one dodkin citie hieruſalem palace quite emptie rich behold poore king refuſeth paye ranſome ſoeuer man would aske ſo might ſcape lyon mouth verye likely ſhoulde haue bene vtterly vndone herevpon god ſendeth prophet mocketh enemy go lay head togither deuiſe yee yee yet ſhall yee bring none enterpriſes paſſe whyſo lord ſetteth himſelfe againſt practizes maineteyne people churche thus ſee haue ſayde behoueth v take heede wee put leſſon vre therefore wee bee come point wee knowe whither way v yea euen ſeemeth vtterly vndoone alreadie let v flee goodneſſe god eaſily finde meanes vnknowne v aboue thing ſoeuer ſee wicked perſecute v quarel goſpell let v doubt god vtter power ſpeciall maner behalfe like theſe dayes true god enemy full ynoughe ſuttle deuiſes haue mayſter wit diuell hath ſhoppe well furniſhed ſuch ſtuffe pope adherent haue wyles ynow diuell forge ynow ſtill ſee miſcheeuous practizes ſide ſee thoſe men thinke greateſt skill kept wage blaſpheme god ſlaunder doctrine truthe make v hated worlde finally buy ſell v ſides intent wee ſhould come vtter decay vvhen theſe thing aforeſayd come eye haue elſe wayte pacience ſpecially ſeing ſure god well tell hold hande faſt tyed haue ſought corner wit prolled aboute whole earthe yea mounted aboue cloud god ſuffer put thing execution furthermore hee well able make thoſe men dullardes take themſelues politike wiſe men ſay make ſo dull euen little child ſhall laugh beaſtlineſſe according ſee verye deede wee marke god truth incountred adayes theſe clawebackes pope vpholders ſhall ſee ſo beſotted likely men could come ſuch doltiſhneſſe specially man marke thoſe weene themſelues cunningeſt ſhould ſeeme confederate v wee haue giuen wage mocke antichriſt mayſter would faine pleaſure diſgrace proofe hereof man reade bookes ſay ſpeake fauour v part knowe ſo vvhereof commeth doubt god accompliſheth thing ſpoken heere knowe manifeſtly ſeing god ſheweth deed thing hath ſpoken vaine let v learne ſtay ourſelues vpon douting able ouerthrow al practiſes deuiſes ſuch take themſelues cunningeſt hee make grope hygh noone blindfolded darke hee ſayeth expreſly god ouertaketh wyſe theyr wylyneſſe vvhen eliphas vſeth worde wyſe hee doth maner men glorifie themſelues behalfe vviſdome ſingular gift god good cōmendable thing good ſooth whence cōmeth holy ghoſt fountaine welſpring thereof according alſo holie ſcripture ſheweth v wee ſelues alſo knowe ſo vnthankfull seing wiſdome ſo excellent thing condemned certein wittineſſe wylyneſſe whiche wee ſee wicked enemy god deſerueth called wiſdome muche boaſte taken bee ſo worldwarde eliphas vſeth ſame worde according alſo ouercommon ſay behold yonder go wyſe man ment wyſe man effect diueliſh creature man bee taken wyſe man hee muſt haue loyaltie faythfulneſſe vpright dealing conſcience hee muſt bee able mocke whole world muſt able aduaunce himſelfe hee muſt haue many fayre colour beguile deceiue men withall man full wiſdome yet meane ſhall haue nothing fraude naughtineſſe hee ſhall haue nothing hypocryſie diſsimulation man bee mynded walke ſimplicitie vprightneſſe meneth man wrong tuſh ſhall counted dolt idiot yea although hee haue witte ynough euen wicked men themſelues inforced confeſſe ſo much faine ſay yee ſee ſuch man wiſe ynough liſted put foorth himſelfe careleſſe paſſeth nothing welter owne eaſe without putting himſelfe hazard behold howe world iudgeth ſo bycauſe ſuche one giueth himſelfe craftineſſe ſnatching men forſomuch world hath worde wiſdome mouth vnhaloweth holie thing howbeit faſly abuſed yee ſee eliphas ſayeth verie well let v put cace theſe wyles wiſdome deed termed commonly taken bee howbeeit ſo wyll graunt title yet notwythſtanding god knoweth well ynough howe diſappoint owne naughtineſſe ſhewed ſayd wiſdome whereof wicked vaunte ſelues worthye ſo honorable title wherfore al ſaid wylineſſe thus yee ſee haue marke text nowe muſt receiue warning belowly ſee god put himſelfe heere principall partie againſt ſuch practyze euill againſt neybours ſeeke winde ſuttletie vvhen wee ſee god ſetteth himſelf againſt behalfe ſheweth himſelfe bee aduerſarie partie pray ought haue good hold ſelues notwithſtanding wee bee tempted vſe crafte ſuttletie therewithall haue witte inough bring matter example maye oftentimes happen god putteth good men handes whome wee may beguile leade noze prouerb ſayth verie well ſuch occaſions offered wee ought haue good ſtay conſidering howe god ſayeth yee vſe deceyte guyle make warre againſte men againſt mee true maye eaſily beguyle ſillie ſoule verie deede leueling therefore ſtep ſhewe mine office daſh diſappoint al vngracious practizes wicked folke take hand brag much liſt owne wiſdome put confuſion euerye man ſhall laugh skorne wherefore bycauſe enterpryſes againſt yee beare ſelues hande ye bee able compaſſe thing policy wile ſhall fynde howe wiſedome mee furthermore aboue caſe ſtandeth vpon walking god let v looke rid clenze ourſelues hypocriſie woorſt wylineſſe whole world men woulde beguyle god ſay doo vſe ſuche language ſo haue printed hart without cauſe prophet eſaye ſayeth vvo dig caues vnder earth ſhould ſay yee could hyde ſelues whome euen god himſelfe ouerryfe adayes vvhat bee ſeene worlde firſt al men doo thinke concerning god man thinketh himſelfe ſuttle ynough ſcape hande verye cauſe wicked deſpizers god run royot beare themſelues hande beaſtlineſſe v afrayd iudgemēt come vvhen ſee v ſtande vpon ſame wit ſee v exhort people feare wrathe vengeance god ſhew maye bee prepared v make mocke ſaying ſee theſe fellowes turmoyle themſelues vayne yet let v ceaſe make luſtie cheere muſt needes come god well tyme woorth monie beholde diueliſh blaſphemies whiche man ſhall heare although paſſe theyr mouthes yet hart full fraught ſhort ſee vngodlineſſe ſo vnreaſonable outrageous theſe dayes may well ſayde men make reckening prouoke god anger let v lerne therfore ſide walke ſuch ſinglehartedneſſe god may compelled lift vp hys hand execute dreadfull power wherof mention made heere wit periſh ne ouertaken owne wylineſſe thus ſee haue mark ſentence conſequently ſayd god delyuereth ſworde hande myghtie hee whiche afflicted ſhall haue hope hereafter mouth wickedneſſe ſhall bee ſtopped added comfort god child elſe ſtate worlde tormenting many greefs troubling manye anguiſſhes anoyances vve continuall battell true god ſpareth v haue ſayd heretofore bycauſe ſeeth weake ſhould gyue bridle looce satan mate ſhould deuoured firſt chop vvell lord keepeth v brooded vnder hys wing yet doth ſuffer v vexed troubled haue many hartſores giuen v wherefore intent ſhould prouoked deſire help alſo intent ſhould learne take heede ourſelues ſurpriſed satan cauſe decay negligence whiche flee vnto god ſuch wiſe bee prouoked call vpon lo maner v muſt world wit muſt afflicted deede word ſignifieth poore oppreſſed thys place ſignifyeth alſo well humbled brought low ſo bycauſe pouertie true ſcholemiſtreſſe bring men meeldneſſe may highmynded themſelues haue ſayd ouerhardineſſe ſpirituall drunkenneſſe aduenture farre may walke according meaſure aſſuring themſelues god ſuccour euerie minute houre ſhoulde bee vtterly vndone thus yee ſee ſay god child muſt bee fayne bee beſet rounde many affliction world purpoſe partaker god kingdome hereafter ſee little cace rich mē commonly puffed vp ſtatelineſſe ſo dazeled pompes pleaſures verye harde matter make humble true whenſoeuer pleaſeth god hee ſaue ryche great one well pooreſt moſte deſpyzed brydling laying ſuch affliction vpon may bee poore meane euen midſt ryches may know howe ſtate miſerable thereby conſtreined ſeeke god hang wholly vpon thus yee ſee plight god ſetteth v firſt afterwarde ſayde hee plucketh v backe ſword deliuereth v throte hand ouermightie woord god faithfull one ſhould mainteined ordinarie meanes ſhould alwayes haue army redineſſe reuenge themſelues bee aſſayled enimies ſhoulde haue great fortification ſhould bee ſtrongly alyed ſuch thing ſhalbe vnprouided ſuch geere worldward elſe haue ſhall barre enimies beeing ſtrong mightie ſo ſhould bee able ſtande againſte meanes vvee ſee wee muſt bee mainteined worldly meanes whenſoeuer bee hemmed ſuch myghtier wee ſeeke nothyng elſe ouerwhelme v reſcowed end ſhould know god defē deth v preſerueth v vnder protection wee bee brooded vnder wing ſuch ſort ſuffereth wicked worke malice vpon v fayne would readie letted aboue thus yee ſee haue marke deede wee ſee ſufficient cleere mirrour theſe dayes howe goeth worlde v ſeemeth god enimies ſtarke mad churche ſhoulde eate v vp wyth one grayne salte prouerb ſayth man make compariſon power ala power ſyde vvee one little flocke ſheepe one heard woolues infinite number woolues whole world full ſuch could fynd heart eate verie bowel v ſatiſfyed putting v ſingle death ſuche crueltie among man may well perceiue altogither helliſh seing power ſo great meane whiche ſeeke nothing deſtroye v make cleane riddance v yet neuertheleſſe wee continue ſtyll chaunce liue one day yet wel ſeene thereby god executeth office whiche ſpoken wit deliuereth oppreſſed hand ouermightie vve ſee howe ought better confirmed truſt god hath begonne ſo hee continue ende poore church threatened conſpyred againſt ſo ſhee ſeemeth alredy good half oppreſſed yet notwithſtanding remedie thing ſo hath ſayde hath forgotten cunning knoweth meanes howebeit vnknown vnto v therefore let v tarie leyſure paciently concluſion ſayth ſhal hope afflicted heereafter mouth wickedneſſe ſhall bee ſtopped declared vnto v purpoſe al haue herd hitherto hath bin ſpoken wit intent ſhould learn truſt god verie hard matter doe true euerie man proteſt truſteth god truſting importeth much tell vtter ſo much euen whiche ſhall haue ſtudied leſſon lyfe long ſhall haue profited wel haue learned half wit bee throughly perſuaded god wyll forſake vvhen poynt ſay well ſettled heartes bee great forwardneſſe lyfe expreſly ſayde hope heereafter ſo muſt hope againſt hope ſay mynde ſh • wee truſt god good earneſt muſt likelihod hope worldward v truſt vnto death muſt hem v ſides muſt ſo ouercaſt darkneſſe ſpect may one ſpark light comforte v bee ſhort wee muſt haue nothing left v ſaue promis god hath made v ſaying sauiour notwithſtanding ſemeth withall turne backe vpon v hath ſhaken v yea euen fauoreth enemy putteth cudgell hande ſtrike v altogither againſt v ſay tydeth yet neuertheleſſe muſt truſt continually thus yee ſee ſaide hope hereafter oppreſſed eliphas ſhuld ſay vvhen god child become laſt caſt ſo wote way turne waye eſcape yet let ceaſe hope god ſhewe himſelfe father sauiour neuer fayle conditionally reſt themſelues vpon ſayde promis ſhall hope hereafter oppreſſed ceaſe haue eye lyfe prepared though ſee death eye lo howe wee ought practyze doctrine moreouer though enemy confounded firſt daſh yet god work ſuche wiſe ſhame ſhall light vpon ſpyght teeth ment ſaying mouth wickedneſſe ſhalbe ſtopped aſmuch ſay wicked ſhall know reply againſt god iudgemēt part behoueth v haue mouth open glorifye god muſt reſemble wieked confounded ceaſe neuer whit blaſpheme god grynde teethe although haue reply againſt ſame ſaying cloſeth vp hundreth ſeuenth pſalme god prouidence ſpoken ſaid god puniſhed inhabiters lande ſinnes ſo one ſort vexed warre ſickeneſſe another ſort ſuffered much inconuenience bothe sea lande commeth deliuering miſeries good men haue whereof glorifie therewithall mouth wickedneſſe ſtopped ſay although wicked dooers deſyre nothing mocke god caſt skoffs againſt yet muſt ſhet vp may knowe ſay vtterly confounded ſhame report knowe god prouidence gouerning thing heere beneath ſee iudgements ſo manifeſt let v learne glorifie holie name therwithall let v flee vnto oure aduerſities ſhall haue ſuccoured v let v render thanks vnto accordingly let v caſt downe ourſelues preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying voutſafe make v perceiue better wee haue done intent knowing vnworthie helped hande may ſo much willinger reſorte vnto ſuccour folowing way ſheweth v wit wee may come lord ieſus chriſt finde grace meanes heauenly throne may come thither diſpleaſed ourſelues ſinnes beſeeching clenze v intente nothing may hinder v reſorting vnto obteining requeſts according ſhal perceiue bee expedient v maye pleaſe graunt grace onely vnto v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage error darkneſſe right waye ſaluation whereof maye pleaſe rayſe vp true faythfull miniſters worde ſeeke owne profite vaineglorie aduauncement holyname▪ welfare flocke contrariwiſe roote ſectes errours hereſies ſeeds trouble diuiſion among people end may liue good brotherly concord c xxj sermon fifth vpon fifth chapter 17 beholde man bliſſed vvhome god correcteth therefore refuze thou chaſtizement almightie 18 hethat maketh vvound vvhich ndeth vp vvhich ſmyteth vvhiche bringeth lyfe heretofore eliphas hath declared power god wee myght better readineſſe receiue doctrine hee addeth wee ſee cauſe ſo teachable requiſite namely bycauſe wee knowe maieſtie god 〈…〉 ſtande awe therefore wee haue neede ſhewe howe god gouerneth world conſider infinite rightuouſneſſe power wiſedome nowe wicked bee confounded bycauſe god ſheweth himſelfe againſt ſo haue mouthes ſtopped muſte become v god muſte conſtreine v doe honour inough that▪ giueth v occaſion hee ſheweth howe iuſt cauſe v wee muſt come good accord let v beare mynd hath bene declared heretofore namely god iudgements layde afore v matter laught dalie behoueth creature tremble ſayd man bliſſed whome god chaſtiſeth therfore wee muſt refuſe correction almightie man ſhoulde tell v god doeth men wrong becommeth iudge vſeth great ſeueritie rigour towardes verely ought touch v neare inough yet wee would bee ſo aſtoniſhed doctrine man giuen v knocke heade beetle vvhat bee done muſt ſome ſweeteneſſe bee mingled may take ſome taſte ſhall bee ſayde vnto v aſſuring ſelues profitable oure ſaluation eliphas hath ſet forth god iudgementes generall diſpoſe v feare humilitie nowe hee ſheweth god bee louing vnto v ſo euer world goe ſpecially chaſtizeth v neuer vſeth ſuch ſharpneſſe towardes v make v feele goodneſſe mercie therewithal intent wee ſhould approche vnto bee diſmayed like thoſe afrayde bee confounded god meaneth maieſtie ſhoulde bee ſo dreadfull v meaning drawe v vnto ende wee ſhould loue doth v good alſo euen chaſtizeth v ſinnes thus wee ſee effect haue gather vpon ſentence ſhoulde ſeeme ſentence contrarie written elſe holie scripture miſeries aduerſities wee ſuffer earthly life proceede ſinne conſequently god curſe howe theſe thing agree wee ſhould bliſſed god chaſtizeth v yet neuertheleſſe al miſeries come vnto v hand many ſignes diſpleaſure wee haue ended hee curſeth v whence come happineſſe ioy god contrarie part god againſt v wee ſee oure life curſed againe wee feele god angrie v puniſhing v ſhoulde ſeeme ſmall bliſſedneſſe wee haue marke heere howe eliphas hath eye intent ende whereat god ameth chaſtizeth men true god doth v well vnderſtand abhorreth ſinne verie deede order appointed making worlde troubled hee handleth v like father yee ſee aduerſities life ſhewe v ſome ſigne god curſe ende thereby wee ſhoulde vnderſtande ſinne diſpleaſeth hee hateth abhorreth beare bycauſe hee fountayne rightuouſneſſe yet god hath ſo declared hatred hee beareth againſt ſin alſo haue v perceiue hee draweth exhorteth ſummoneth v repentance ſo doth god ſcourge v token loth wee ſhould periſhe hee dothe rather prouoke v returne vnto correction recordes god readie receiue v mercie wee acknowledge oure faultes aske ſorgiueneſſe vnfeynedly seeing cace ſtandeth ſo wee muſte thinke ſtraunge eliphas ſhoulde ſaye man happye whome god chaſtyzeth wee muſt beare mynde two point haue touched whereof one ſo ſoone aduerſitie befalleth v wrath god muſt come eye ſo wee may vnderſtand cannot awaye ſinne therevpon wee muſt conſider rigour iuſtice ſo wee may bee heartely ſorie wee haue offended beholde poynte wee oughte beginne withall alſo let v moreouer take holde god goodneſſe hee ſuffereth v runne deſtruction without drawing v home himſelfe meaning bring v backe ſo often ſcourgeth v thus yee ſee wee haue conceyue affliction remayneth yet one harde poynte meane ſeaſon wee ſee howe affliction lyght vpon men without exception god chaſtizeth thoſe whome hee mynded ſhewe mercie wee ſee alſo hee puniſheth caſtawayes yet ſhall ſame turne greater damnation vvhat auayled roddes pharao felt ſauing made vnexcuſable bycauſe hee continued ſtubborne vnable bee amended agaynſte god euen ende muche god ſcourgeth bothe good bad wee ſee experience affliction fyre kindle god wrath againſte caſtawayes followeth therevpon god chaſtizeth many folkes reckened bee happie therefore herevpon behoueth v note eliphas ſpeaketh heere▪ thoſe whome god chaſtizeth child profite hee declareth followeth ſaying god byndeth vp woundes hee hath made ſwadling laying playſters making whole yee ſee howe eliphas reſtreyneth ſentence thoſe whome god maketh chaſtizementes turne true amendment ſentence bee ſomewhat darkeſt bee layde foorthe ſomewhat large yee may haue ſure cleere reſolulion let v marke howe god worketh towarde caſtawayes true hee exhorteth men repentance chaſtizeth haue ſaid already one hee ſhould wake vppe ſay▪ knowe faultes continue longer returne vnto mee readie ſhewe mercie yet well knowne ſayde chaſtiſements profit men alſo hee giueth al men grace return vnto inough god ſtrike v hande excepte hee touch v within alſo holy ſpirit god ſoften hardneſſe oure heartes fall v wyth pharao men like vnto ſtithies anuilds beating vpon able change nature ſee beate backe blowes againe euen ſo vntill god haue touched v quicke within certeine wee ſhall nothing kicke againſt gather rankour whenſoeuer chaſtiſeth v ſhall gnaſh teeth ſhall doe nothing elſe ſtorme good ſoothe wickedneſſe men ſo miſcheuous ſo headſtrong ſo deſperate god chaſtiſeth ſpue blaſphemies ſhew themſelues vtterly paſt amendment ſo way bring vnto reaſon let v learne till god haue touched v holy ſpirit vnpoſsible chaſtiſements ſhould ſerue bring v back repentance rather ſhall make v wex worſe worſe yet ſayde god rightuous ſo ſo therby men conuinced ſo much god hild bay ſort puniſhing ſinnes might pleade ignorance neuer wiſt ouerſhot themſelues bicauſe god prouoked acknowledge fault haue felt hande god ſo haue beene fayne perceiue iudgementes ſpyte teethe haue beene ſummoned yet notwithſtanding haue onely gone onwarde euill woorſe alſo bene puffed vp open manifeſt rebellion againſt god hereby ſee effecte haue mouth ſtopped haue ſay themſelues ye ſee howe god ſheweth iuſtice often hee puniſheth men notwithſtanding ſame found correction amendment furthermore god chaſtiſeth caſtawayes one ſhould hand begin ſhew wrath vpon fire already kindled true vtterly conſumed preſent time howbeit token horrible vengeance prepared latter day yee ſee many men touched god hande whiche notwithſtanding accurſed begin hell alreadie world according haue example ſuch amende wicked life god ſendeth affliction vpon man ſhall ſee take corner ſtande barking like dogges though able yet ceaſe ſhewe continuall woodneſſe elſe like reſtie iades compariſon made xxxij pſalme finally altogither ouerſotted ſo knowe owne harme meane conſider hande ſtriketh prophet ſayth crye ala ſhall feele blowes thinke neuer vpon god hand neyther knowe howe viſiteth vvee ſee oure eye many men vnhappie beeing chaſtiſed god hande bycauſe profite ſchoole yet take good correction heere mention made preciſely thoſe whome god chaſtiſeth touching holie ſpirite therefore let v aſſure ſelues god maketh v feele hande ſo humbled vnder ſame hee doth v ſpeciall good turne priuiledge hee giueth none owne chyldren vvhen wee feele correction whiche hee ſendeth v moreouer taught miſlyke oure ſelues offence ſyghe grone flee mercie refuge ſay wee haue ſuch feeling god chaſtiſementes token hee hath wrought heartes ſpirite hygh poynte wiſedome growe mynde man muſte proceede free goodneſſe god holie ghoſt muſt firſt haue ſoftened ſayde curſſed hardneſſe ſtubborneſſe wherevnto wee inclyned nature let v vnderſtande preſent text ſpoken preciſely god child ſtubborne agaynſte hande ouermayſtred tamed holie ghoſte intent ſhould ſtriue agaynſt affliction hee ſendeth vnto yet ſaying ſeeme ſtraunge opinion fleſhe vvhy ſo vvhatſoeuer inconueniences fall otherwiſe wee would haue terme aduerſities vvhen wee indure hunger thirſte colde heate wee ſay euery one theſe aduerſitie vvhy ſo wee would fayne haue oure owne appetite deſires good ſoothe maner ſpeaking ſay miſhapes god ſendeth vpon v aduerſities ſay thing againſte v without reaſon neuertheleſſe muſt vnderſtande ende namely god ſcourging v bycauſe ſinnes therefore let v bee beguyled flattering ſelues furthermore haue alreadie tolde onely requiſite v conſider god ſcourging v bycauſe hee hateth ſinne ſummoning v make v feele iudge alſo need reach armes vnto v ſhew v redy one v ſo euer wee ſhall come true repentance wee perceyue whome god chaſtyzeth happie notwithſtanding ſhunne aduerſitie much poſsibly alſo ſhall neuer conſent doctrine receyue hart vntill fayth haue made v behold goodneſſe god vſeth towardes ſeruantes draweth backe himſelfe may better comprehende lette v marke becommeth men god leaueth themſelues maketh countenance clenzing ſinnes looke vppon man gyuen euill example lette v take deſpyzer god god lette alone ſeeme chaſtyze yee ſhall ſee ſuche one harden himſelfe dyuell ſhall carye ſtill therefore much better bin chaſtized ſooner ſo greateſt miſhap light vpon v god ſuffereth v welter owne wickedneſſe thē muſt wee needes rotte away ende verely greatly deſired men would come vnto god owne accord without ſpurring would cleaue vnto without warning giuen fault without rebuking ſay thing greatly wiſhed yea moreouer fault v angel deſyring nothing yeeld obedience maker honour loue father foraſmuch ſo froward ceaſe offend god beſides play hypocrite ſeeking cōceale faultes foraſmuch ſo greate pride v would haue god let v alone vphold v luſts fynally would iudges rather ſhould conſidering ſay howe ſo froward ſtandeth god hand vſe ſome violēt remedie draw v vnto hee ſhould handle v altogither gentleneſſe would become vve ſee thing partly euen yong child theyr father mother chaſtize ſende gallowes true perceyue howbeit experience ſheweth haue commō prouerbes father cocker child marre mother yet much fond flattering meane whyle bring naught herein god ſheweth v ſmall beames thing much himſelfe hee ſhould handle v mildely wee ſhould vtterly vndone paſt recouerie therefore muſt fayne ſhewe himſelfe father towards v rough v ſeeing ſo ſturdie nature ſhould deale gently v ſhould take good ye ſee may atteyne truth doctrine mā happie whome god chaſtizeth wit conſidering oure nature namely ſtubborne hard framed order god ſhoulde neuer chaſtize v profit therfore nedefull ſhould hold v ſhort ſhould gyue v ſo many laſſhes whippe ſhould conſtreyned regard whither would ſhall length come conclude man happie whome god chaſtizeth yea verely adde ſecond grace vnto wit hee make roddes correction auayle cauſe holy ghoſte worke ſuch wiſe hart man may hardned aduaunce himſelfe againſt god maye haue care thinke vpon owne ſinnes bee rightly tamed humbled thus ye ſee ſayd greateſt benefyte haue corrected god hand ſo much haue caſt account full wee ſhall fynde correction whiche hee ſendeth v profite bread eate ſtarue hunger god wyll haue pitie vpon v taking v worlde liue ſtill heere bylowe ceaſſe prouoke wrath ſheweth himſelfe ſo good liberall father towardes v ſee ye ſhamefull vnthankfulneſſe pray bin better bin borne dead ſhoulde ſo prolong life damnation god preuent v vſe chaſtizements preſeruatiue medicine tarrie till diſeaſe farre ouergrowen great benefite v ſuch one ought wiſh oft ſo long correction hard bitter v fleſh prouoketh v impacience deſpaire let v learne call leſſon remembraunce man happie whome god chaſtizeth howbeit imagination ſay ſo contrarily wee ſurmize nothing better ſpared borne withall certeinly although know experience without cauſe holie ghoſt hath vttered ſuch ſentence yet notwithſtanding meant thereby correction haue indure euermore ſowre painefull themſelues according apoſtle ſayeth god alſo haue v feele pricking put v payne feele greefe god correcteth v obedientneſſe furthermore ſhall learne angrie ſelues ſinnes ſhall bee afrayde god iudgements tamed aright behoueth v greeued aduerſitie whiche god ſendeth v aud although aduerſitie turned benefyte god thereby ſhew loueth v yet requiſite ſome pricking paynefulneſſe intent wee may perceyue wrath god diſpleaſed ſelues ſinnes yet heere withall wee muſte mount vp higher haue found nature inclined euill let v confeſſe ourſelues haue neede god ſhould vſe ſome ſharpe puniſhment purge v withall ſee phiſicions put ſome kind poyſon medicine ſee malady great deeperooted phiſicion ſeeth well ynough weakening poore man vnſtrengethening veynes ſinewes ſpecially gentler meanes wyll ſerue letting bloud euen muche drawe ſubſtance mannes bodye yet muſt • e needes vſe ſuch violent meanes remedie ſuch maladie euen ſo god fayne worke v howbeit ſame bee extraordinarie maner wee ſay wee bee happie bee chaſtiſed god hande muſt leade v vnto lowlineſſe ſeeing god cannot procure oure ſaluation ſhewing himſelfe bee againſt v ſayd iuſtly maruellous corruptneſſe men ſith god cannot sauioure father handling roughly nature ſhewe himſelfe gracious gentle creature followeth order would keepe reſpect himſelfe doth nothing elſe 〈◊〉 ſpred goodneſſe vpon v ſuch wiſe ſhould repleniſhed grace wholly rauiſhe 〈…〉 thereat handle v gently according h 〈…〉 owne nature inclination vndone therefore faine alter mind ſay ſhew himſelfe otherwiſe towardes v hee would cauſe thereof vnrecouerable naughtineſſe therefore wee haue good cauſe heere bee confounded ſhame ſee hee • ayne yee would ſay diſguiſe himſelfe hee intende ſhoulde periſhe thus muche touching thys ſentence howbeit foraſmuchas cannot well applye doctrine vſe without adding followeth let v ioyne togither ſayd refuſe correction almightie hath made wound bindeth vp layeth conuenient playſters hee hathe ſent maladie hee healeth heere exhorted refuze god correction cauſe thereof added byandby witte bycauſe god giue good iſſue lo wherein conſiſteth ſayde happineſſe whereof eliphas hathe made mention let v learne heere god purpoſeth exhort v pacience telleth v wee cannot eſchew hand wee loſe time rebelling againſt wee muſt paſſe way ſpyte teeth wee cannot withſtand neceſsitie pacience lumbard ſay whē wee ſhoulde grynde oure teeth manner therewithall lift vp ſelues againſt god much v lyeth ſo wee ſhoulde pacient perforce therefore wee wyll pacient godward muſte drawen another manner witte wee muſt bee ſoone comforted sainct paule ſpeaketh fiftenth romanes hee putteth theſe two thing togither inſeparable witte intent wee may haue pacience aduerſities muſt haue taſt god goodneſſe muſt reioyce grace muſt aſſure ſelues ſcourging v welfare thing ſhewed v ſtreyne ſayd refuze correction almyghtie hee surgion ſores hee ſende health diſeaſes god ſheweth v heere howe hys meening mennes ſubmitting themſelues vntoo ſhould ſay seeing wee noneotherwiſe nedes muſt god haue mayſtrie v wee cannot exempte ourſelues iuriſdiction cace ſtandeth vppon comming ſo lorde ſayeth bee yee pacient humble ſelues vnto mee take warning iudgementes yee murmure againſt mee ne ſtomack matter otherwiſe ye ſhall bee fayne bee beaten downe hand yea euen ſuch wiſe yee ſhall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed ye hūbly acknowledge fault come craue pardon ye ſhall feele aſſuagement miſeries ſuche ſorte yee ſhall haue cauſe yeeld mee thankes euen middes greateſt trouble beholde ſay haue muze vpon wee may haue true pacience seeing owne nature wee bee ſtubborne againſt god angrie touche v hys little finger ſeeing alſo wee haue ſuche proudeneſſe v wee thinke god dothe v wrong chaſtize v seeyng ſaye wee haue theſe twoo ſo greate vice harde matter purge v muche therefore muſt mind leſſon ſhewed v witte god ſcourging v meeneth bring v backe himſelfe yea euen benefite welfare furthermore behoueth v marke well promiſſe ſet downe heere witte god beale woundes • e hath made true healing pertayneth men onely ſuche receyue correction meekely way lette v marke god haue menne put minde returne vnto conſidering gentleneſſe whiche ſheweth many taſte thing conteyned heere alſo cauſe ſee ſo much impacience ſo much murmuring ſo muche blaſphemie vſed againſt god correction light repentance none ſee ſeemeth men conſpired withſtand god vttermoſt vvhy bycauſe fewe conceiue preſente doctrine receyue ſayde promiſſe ſay lorde thine office bynde vp woundes whiche thou haſt made heale ſore therefore lette v remember well leſſon ſpecially ſeing ſo often repeted onely ſentence holye ghoſte ſpeaketh ſo alſo wee ſee howe ſayde lorde ſmiteth v healeth v againe third day ſo hee haue gyuen v ſtripe rodde ſhoulde therefore imagine hee bee mercifull v wee come vnto vvhen ſuche exhortacions made vnto v prophetes one god ſhoulde ſay vntoo v true haue ſcourged ſpredde mercie vpon ſhall bee euerlaſting ye felt anger ſigne choler father diſpleaſed child bycauſe haue hated bycauſe haue bene fayne make feele frute ſinnes doo vnderſtande hate neuertheleſſe end ye ſhall finde purpoſe nothing el heale woundes cure diſeaſes haue ſent true firſt bluſhe ſeeming meete god ſhuld take pleaſure wounde men firſt heale vvhy rather doth hee lette v alone peace proſperitie haue alreadye ſhewed woundes god maketh good medicine v double grace whiche god graunteth v heere one god ſcourgeth v procureth welfare drawing v repentance purging v ſinnes ſpecially ſinnes know god contented remedie inconueniences alreadye preſent conſidereth alſo muche ſeede ſickneſſe hidden within v therefore layeth holde v aforehande redreſſeth thing amiſſe ſingular benefyte doth vnto v hee ſeemeth come agaynſte v naked ſworde pretendeth angrie wyth v yet notwithſtanding ſheweth himſelfe phiſition ſo euer world go marke ſpeciall poynte followeth ſeconde grace alſo well ſhewed vnto v witte god bindeth vp woundes hath made healeth whiche haue alledged alreadye sainct paule hee ſuffereth v tempted aboue power giueth good iſſue miſeries although correction bee profitable yea neceſſarie v god fayne prouoke v diuers meanes returne vnto hym yet notwithſtanding hee ſpareth v looketh altogither ſinnes require wee able beare heere yee ſee ſayeth chaſtize v man hande ſaye hee proceede according owne mightie power woulde become v god ſhould ſtretch hys arme againſt v ala creature able ſtande verely needeth ſhew one angrie loke behold world ſhould periſhe though hee doo ſo yet let hym withdrawe ſpirite muſte needes decay ſayde hundred fourth pſalme handleth v gently therwithall alſo withdraweth hande ſeeth v ſore oppreſſed ſpareth v wee bowe vnder burthen condicionally wee bee lowly meeke mynde wee knowe hee telleth v lawe wee fall ſturdineſſe againſt hym hee ſturdie towardes v ſayeth alſo eightenth pſalme ſtubborne againſt ſuch ſtubborne vvee make fayre hande ſtout ſtubborne furniſh againſt god let v thinke compaſſe hym meanes hee bee froward wyth frowarde ſay bee ouer terrible hee ſeeth men vſe ſuch obſtinate malice againſt hym therefore needes muſt bee vtterly oppreſſed wee bee meeke minde ſubmitte ſelues mightie hande god certaine ſhall alwayes fynd thing whiche ſpoken lette v followe whiche ſhewed v apoſtle humble ſelues ſayeth hee vnder mightie hande god ſoeuer ſtoupeth downe head ſoeuer boweth knee god honoure ſhall feele hande ready releeue hee fall hee lifteth himſelfe vp againſte god ſhall ſure feele god hand againſt hym deſire wee feele god hand vnder v ayde v let v humble ſelues ſoeuer aduaunceth himſelfe hee muſte needes ruſhe againſte hande god feele thunderclap ſhall vtterly ouerwhelme ſo let v beare wel mynd leſſon ſayde refuſe correction almightie vven ſhall haue caught hold god goodneſſe ſo wee know fatherly loue ſerue ſweeten affliction whyche otherwiſe ſeeme harſhe ſharpe v meane euery one v muſte applye thys leſſon owne vſe bee eaſie matter v ſay bliſſed bee god chaſtizing men ſo yet meane ſeaſon wee ourſelues chaſtized prayſe hym rather grudge againſt truly muſt deale ſo ſoeuer ſelues ſcourged let v receyue correction paciently let v ſelues take thoſe thing incoragements skil giue comfort vnto others let v vnderſtande man v hath many vice ſame many diſeaſes god cannot heale meanes afflictiōs ſendeth v true liſted vſe abſolute power could well doo otherwiſe ſpeake god almightineſſe treate meane keepe towardes v aſmuch god wil hold ſaid order remedying vice ſcourging v behoueth euery v ſtudy leſſon himſelfe end may confeſſe wyth dauid lord profite thou haſt brought low dauid ſpeaketh men ſay lord thou haſt done well chaſtize ſuch haue done amiſſe beginneth himſelfe ſo muſt doo holy ghoſt ſheweth v heere ſaying behold man happie god chaſtizeth ſo men cannot abide gouerned god ſtriue againſt hym continue always vnamendable therefore needefull profitable chaſtized god aſmuch wee ſee god hand lifted vp dayes generally ſeuerally ought touched doctrine apparant enormity worlde come wonder god ſhew ſuch rigour yet certaine beareth much v thereof true man may ſee puniſheth wicked doth v notwithſtanding rebellious obſtinate vttermoſt wil yeeld themſelues vnto god warning man giue ſummoneth affliction layeth eye perſons mē ſpecially thoſe maketh feele owne perſons condemne ſtubborne wilfulneſſe bycauſe continue ſo rebellious obſtinate ſide let v pray ſuffer v bee ſo hardened aſſoone hee ſhall ſhewe v ſignes diſpleaſure worke ſuch wiſe v holy ſpirite hee may ſoften ſayd hardneſſe hart grace may take place whē ſhal haue receiued v mercie according haue neede therof may perceyue toto ouerblockiſh let v fall downe face good god aknowlegemēt fault beſeching make v ſo miſlike thē may deſire nothing ſo much returne craue pardon framing ſelues wholly good wil according hee hath ſhewed ſame v holy law walke al life long feare ſo let v ſay almightie god c xxij sermon ſixt vpon fifth chapter 19 vvill deliuer thee ſixe affliction ſeuenth euill ſhall touch thee 20 time death ſhall preſerue thee death ſvvord time vvarre 21 thou ſhalt bee hidden ſcourge tong thou ſhalt bee afrayd vvhen deſtruction commeth 22 thou ſhalt laugh deſtruction dearth ſhalt afrayde beaſtes fielde 23 thou ſhalt haue league vvith ſtones vvilde beaſtes ſhall bee brought haue peace vvith thee 24 thou ſhalt perceyue thy tent ſuretie viſiting thy houſe thou ſhalte bee greeued 25 thou ſhalt ſee thy linage increace thine ofſpring graſſe ground 26 thou ſhalt come thy graue full recke corne gathered due ſeaſon 27 behold vve haue inquired theſe thing ſo therefore herken marke thy ſelfe yeſterday intreated comforte ſet downe heere faithfull god afflicteth whyche woundes deadlye bicauſe god wil length deliuer miſeries ſo much surgion cure ſtripes truly tempereth ſuch meaſure vtterly oppreſſed bycauſe vpholdeth v pitie feebleneſſe v therefore ſhorte god wonderfull prouidence doth continually cauſe iſſue affliction happie miniſtreth matter gladneſſe vnto v conſidering benefit welfare sainct paule alſo ſpeaketh eyght romanes confirme ſame matter ſayde god delyuer chozen ſixe trouble daungers ſeuenth euill ſhall come heereby ſignified vnto v god perchaunce ſuffer v indure many miſeries wee eſcaped one wee ſhall enter intoo another may continuall exerciſe v time oure life ſo ſhall reſpite poore child god ſhall bee tormented one faſhion another yea behoueth expedient ſo handled bycauſe ſinnes yet neuertheleſſe god giueth affliction good end notwithſtanding number infinite thus ye ſee effect ſhewed v heere haue neede promiſſe conſidering vntowardneſſe v albeit haue felt experience god haue ayded ſuccored v ſome aduerſitie yet afterward daunger agayne ſeemeth v looking ſuccoure hand see yee ouer great vnthankfulneſſe frowardneſſe yet notwithſtanding oft god helpeth thoſe aſſure time come ende mighte alwayes haue recourſe vnto reaſoning thus themſelues ſeeyng god hath helped pitied neede forget ſo long liue therefore call vpon reſort vnto refuge ſure ready alwayes remedie inconueniences happen vnto behold god would aſſure v ſuccoure yet cannot find hart truſt vnto contrary parte doeth v good imagin werie bee ouercloyed v hee woulde haue v trouble rather wee forget releeuing v ſo put truſt hee would wee ſhould vve ſee haue neede mynde well leſſon witte god deliuer v ſixe trouble bene ſayde muſt truſt god onely day two one puſh aſmuche life full many miſeries ſo bee ſooner cropen one aduerſitie commeth another freſh necke ſo wee bee tormented miſeries number therefore inaſmuch haue continuall battell ſhould ouerthrowen incontinently god hande help v wee muſt beleeue certaintie hee fayle v expound text preciſely thogh ſayd god deliuer v miſeries time life ende make v paſſe taking v world like world made ſixe dayes ſo alſo man lyfe willingly cō prehended number commeth reſt god ſtrippeth v mortall body ye ſee maketh ende laboures griefes battells lette ſuffize v haue playne meening texte although wee bee toſſed many miſeries preſent life god continually make v way bring v good hauen ſhort mention made ſeuen correction common maner holy scripture ſayde number seuen importeth greate infinite quantitie ye ſee ſayde prouerbes rightuous man falleth ſeuen time day riſeth agayne true ſome men vnderſtande ment ſinning salomon ſpeaketh miſchaunces fall wee beaten many roddes one commeth ſome diſeaſe time ſome aduerſitie ſome man ſhall trouble v one another ſhall v ſome wrong ye ſee falles goddes child fall ſo ſteade holding vp ſtrong hande ſeemeth letteth tumble downe like little babe haue ſtrength vvhen wee bee ſo falne god dothe alwayes releeue v ſpecially ſayeth another text hee haue hand vnder v ſuffer v fall ouer hard let v learne ſtreyne warned firſt maruell though behoue v come many tribulation god hath ſet v worlde ſame purpoſe end therefore v promiſſe ſelues ſhall wee gayne bearing ourſelues hande ſhall haue thing power haue alſo god alwayes ſuffer v diſappointed expectation bee ſo fooliſh make reckening without ſubmit ſelues gouernement therefore man muſt warrant hymſelfe continuall reſt ſeeing god haue v fight pleaſure exerciſe v ſo furthermore ſith ſee ceaſſe prouoke goddes wrath ſuche ſtore faultes v meete wee ſhoulde therevpon deſire liue oure eaſe pleaſures neuer part inough make v rotte oure owne dung god ſhoulde skoure v affliction let v learne prepare ſelues battaile aſſuring ſelues whyle wee liue world wee paradiſe wee bee haue manie myſeries trouble bycauſe god ſo ſo wee knowe aduerſities profitable v yea neceſſarie ſaluation god faine viſite quicken v vp maner thus muche concerning firſt poynt howe holie ghoſt declareth faithfull ſhall bee ſubiecte many infirmity hee ſpeketh god child euen thoſe hee ſheweth mercie yet notwithſtanding hee ſayeth euen ſhall tormented one affliction alone ſixe ſeuen nowe way wee warned pacient aduerſities let v alſo beare mynde preſent comforte giuen v heere witte god neuer fayle v neede true hee ſuccour v euerie pinche exempt v vtterly myſerie yet ſuccour v due ſeaſon ſhall bee inough v althoughe wee bee driuen afterdeale bee ayded ſo ſoone deſire would craue oure deſires boyling may bee god delayeth letteth v alone trie pacience meane ſeaſon haue ſayde let ſuffize v god hath declared vnto v namely wee ſhall bee diſappointed helpe ſo wee tarie leyſure quietly till ſee good deliuer v thus ye ſee wee haue beare mynde concluſion whenſoeuer god ſhall haue made v wade miſeries ſo hee ſuffereth v enter deliuereth v muche ſaye god continually encreaſe goodneſſe towardes v wee haue felte helpe ſixe time ſay many time often ende hee ſhewe himſelfe yet fauorable towards v meening onely reach v hande time make v way miſeries wherein wee bee alſo take v eternall reſt make end trouble wherewith incompaſſed nowe benefites god beſtoweth vpon v preſent life guide v vnto one marke wit ende ſaluation ſhall perfecte full god giueth v little taſt let v tarie till haue brought thing true perfection ſhall perceiue sauiour lo howe benefites whiche wee receiue worlde ought giue v large hyghe expectation god goodneſſe whiche ſhewed nowe parte wholly hee hath ſayde ſo hee addeth wee ſhall bee delyuered time dearth opinion eliphas declareth heere ſeuen affliction whereof hee hath ſpoken ſo curious expoſition hath ſubſtantialneſſe man reſte fullye vpon therefore let v followe naturall ſence ſuche witte according myſeries infinite wherewith god ſcourgeth v worlde ſo muſte hope ſtretch ſelfe farre wide ende wee maye continually wayte ſayde deliuerance whiche hath promiſed v ſoeuer kynde miſeries wee indure yee ſee heere mention made dearth warre wilde beaſtes ſtormes tempeſtes fyre calamity accordyng wee ſee poore lyfe beſieged ſo many ſortes aduerſities nothing bee thing declared v effect god draweth v dearth onely deliuereth v warre alſo trouble ſoeuer wee bee ſhall fynde hee hath iſſue hande according ſayde hee hath iſſues outgoings deathe hys hande thys right neceſſarie poynte wee ſee ſuperſtition menne witte diſtribute goddes office vntoo others bycauſe ſeeming coulde fynde remedie inconueniences ſhoulde reſorte one place heere yee ſee papiſts make one sainct twoo three fower haue charge ague another haue keeping fruites earth thirde haue rule ſuche diſeaſe imagine ſhoulde reſorte vntoo god haue ague ſhoulde come hym helpe haue dropſie able intende ſo many thing therefore better eche ſeuerall office committed ſeuerall sainct el two three ſo conſequently lyke ſhoulde bee done sainct sainct behold men teare god maieſtie piece diueliſh ſuperſtitions robbe ſorte operation put ouer creature alſo lette v marke well thys doctrine wherein declared vnto v god keepe v plague alſo keepe v ſwoorde ſo men neede go diſtribute hys office thys man lette v aſſure ourſelues sauiour onely parte alſo throughout thing therefore lette v boldely haue recourſe vnto onely one kynde aduerſitie many ſhall come vpon v aſſuring ſelues hys power ſhall extende euen vntoo deathes threaten v according ſayde hath way deliuer v deathe alſo hath wayes incomprehenſible v vvhen wee bee afflicted one ſide god thother ſide make v feele wee bee helped vvhen wee bee locked vp ſo ſeemeth way v ſcape god finde one v yea owne faſhion ſaye aboue vnderſtanding opinion fleſhe way wee bee heere new againe warned prepare ourſelues pacience onely ſome one kind aduerſitie euer betyde v according wee ſee howe menne borne diuers affliction ſay bycauſe ſuche ſtrong inough indure ſome one aduerſitie immediatly bee ouercome ſome temptation example man ſhall finde ſome indure pouertie yet one ſickeneſſe carie away ſuche ſorte ſhall frette againſt god ſhall meane appeace ſome well away ſickneſſe thys thing man doo wrong iniurie man go deface cace haue loſt pacience may nowe bee apparance vertue man reſpect ſome one kynde temptation ſome hee ſhall fayle cauſe behoueth v marke well conteyned thys ſtreyne namely god commende man ſhewing hymſelfe ſtoute ſome one poynt hee bee cold incontinently quayled reſte pacience muſte reache witte wee muſt yeelde ſelues peaceably euer god ſhall ſende v wee bee exhorted bee pacient god ſetteth eye one miſerie twoo three ſayeth euery v muſt take vp croſſe fardell manner fardell muſte thys bee wee muſte make owne packet ſay haue ſuch meaſure ſuch portion belongeth god gyue v burthen aduertizeth v wee ſhall haue bene perſecuted one faſhion wee muſt bee fayne enter intoo newe farre diuers battell therefore wee muſt prepare ſelues therevntoo heere ye ſee alſo affliction tearmed cup drinking glaſſe like phiſition gyueth pacient ſuche quantitie thinketh good pacient muſt fayne receyue drinke ſuch portion phiſition ſhall haue appoynted lyke father cheriſhing hys child cutteth euery pittance gyueth eate drinke hys owne pleaſure euen ſo muſte god diſpoſe v haue authoritie ouer v charge v gyue v ſuch portion miſeries ſhall thinke good seeing caſe ſtandeth ſo lette v remember doctrine ſette downe heere god deliuer v famine tyme dearth hee ſaue v ſwoorde time warre hee defende v wilde beaſtes ſayde menne ſhal onely bee aſſayled ſome famine ſome warre ſome peſtilence otherſome anoyances wilde beaſtes alſo well one ſhall feele may haue many anoyances wee ſee meanes trouble v many enemy neere v god haue hande ſtretched continually haue pitie vppon v deliuer v wee ſee hundred thouſande deathes whiche threaten v incompaſſe v ſides yee ſee howe ſtandeth euery one v hande thynke well vppon daungers wherein knowe howe miſerable ſtate ende may bee earneſt calling vpon god herewithall lette v alſo readie indure paciently ſome one kinde aduerſitie alſo infinite number according ſhal pleaſe god ſcourge euery v ſayde god contenteth himſelfe exercyſing v ſome one ſorte wee muſte bee fayne paſſe fyre water ſaye wee ſhall haue one ſorte affliction alone aſſoone wee paſſed one aduerſitie wee muſt ſtreight wayes enter yee ſee effect ſignified vntoo v heere ſayde immediatly wee ſhall bee league ſtones wilde beaſtes vvhereby eliphas meeneth thing whiche woonte anoy trouble menne ſuche ſtones fielde wilde beaſtes ſhall diſquiet v howe ſhall ſtones fielde trouble v nother walking tilling ground wee knowe tilling grounde painefull bee ſtonie labourſome poore man plough ſhall bee oftentimes daunger breaking hee turne away ſtones lo wherefore lord telleth v ſtones ſhall hurte oure walking labouring fieldes walking ſay haue vnhappie ſtumblingplot alſo addeth beaſtes earthe wee ſee beaſts againſt v true beaſtes ought nature obey v bycauſe god hath giuen man dominion ouer creature ſpecially bycauſe hee hath created beaſtes ende ſhoulde bee ſubiect vnto menne acknowledge man prince reigneth heere beneath according god hath ordeyned yet withſtanding beaſtes fayne riſe vp againſt v bicauſe wee haue done homage god reſpect ſouerayne lordſhip hee hath ouer creature whereof hath made v partaker lyke man holding fee prince beeing leege man committed ſome offence treaſon rebellion goodes whiche hee hath ſhall excheated euen ſo dealeth lorde vnthankfulneſſe ſake hee hath bene fayne bereeue v goodes hee put handes ſo much hee hath armed wylde beaſtes ought yeeld v ful obedience rayſeth vp dayly againſt v behold wherof commeth contrarietie enmitie betweene men beaſtes heere ſayde ſhall league beastes ſaye god reſtrayne
