rage beaſtes ſo ſhall haue deſire v harme truely wee ſee god hath yet vtterly bereft v dominion whych gaue v adam although horſes bulles alſo bee beaſtes full fierceneſſe ſo ſeemeth ſhould ouermayſter menne yet notwithſtanding bee commonly tamed menne bring lure aſmuch mē haue liuing worlde god ſhoulde ſtill remayne ſome trace goodneſſe ſhoulde inioy creature parte yet haue ſayde league ſuche perfection god promiſeth heere neyther conuenient haue behoueth v bee troubled vexed beaſtes intent wee may feele fruite rebellion againſt god yet notwithſtanding ſpeciall gifte whych god gyueth thoſe vnder hys defence protection wit wilde beaſtes peaceable towardes league betweene god treated peace come betwixte ſay true beaſtes haue hitherto bene enimies ſhall bee peace agreement betweene yee ſee promiſed heere yea euen ſingular benefite ſuche ſhrowd themſelues vnder ſhadowe god winges meane howe obteyne ſuche priuiledge ſhewed v yet better oſee hee ſayeth ſeconde chapter god cauſe league bee betweene v wilde beaſtes namely lorde ieſus chriſte place expreſſely handled reſtitution churche whiche decayed deſolate ſayd god wil ſend peace throughout added particular cauſe v bee league wilde beaſtes ſo bycauſe ieſus chriſte vniuerſall heire creature thing gyuen intoo handes wee bee hys member ſhall parttakers benefites whiche father hathe committed perfection yee ſee howe wee may walke al anoyances world without wounding witte bycauſe chriſte keeper ouerſeeth lyfe maynteyne welfare yet notwithſtanding wee ſhall ceaſſe bee troubled according needefull god ſhoulde chaſtyze v diuers ſortes ſoeuer worlde go ſhall finde howe nought ſayde heere god make wilde beaſtes become tame ſo ſhal riſe vp againſt v ſuch rage haue bene wonte doo bycauſe hee holde ſhort heere wee haue profitable leſſon witte wee muſte meaſure aſsiſtaunce god eyeſight promiſſe ſuccoure behighted v aboue ſo yee ſee ſorte god bee honored v witte haue v beholde daungers neere vnto v wee ſee howe alwayes hundred perilles v fall wee muſte therefore ceaſſe truſte ayde god ſaye beholde lord true wee looke onely heere bylow wee ſhall bee totoo much confounded aſmuche thou haſte promiſed helpe v neede life muſte reſte vpon thee wee muſte put intoo thy handes lo heere greate honor wee doo vnto god wee ſhette eye daungers threaten v imbrace promiſe hee hathe made maynteyne welfare ſhewe faythfull muſte yeeld themſelues wholly god protection ſayde ſhall laugh tyme calamitie famine wee ſhall bee ſenſeleſſe wee ought bee ſo laughing heere importeth ſuch boldneſſe afrayd lyke wretched vnbeleeuers know ſay ſee themſelues hazarde lette v marke bothe good badde ſhall feele miſerie pincheth conceyue daungers bee afrayde yet meane ſeaſon vnbeleeuer perceyue miſchiefe towardes yee ſhall ſee ſo caried away fearefulneſſe comforting woorſe menne doo muze continually vppon tormentes according ſayde wicked ſhal flee man foloweth hym another texte ſayd needeth leafe fall atree afright thoſe haue truſt god yee ſee men truſt god committe themſelues wholly vnto ſhall bee ſo ſcared wittes haue reſte according ſayde lawe life ſhall bee hanging threede morning ſhall ſay poſsible may go foorth vntill night night ſhall bee perplexitie knowe may ſee morning yee ſee regarde god continuall thoughtfulneſſe ſo onely alſo ſo extreme agony wote whither bee alyue dead contrariwiſe god child haue perceyued inconueniences haue ſighed bene attached ſome feare alwayes come ſaye thus lorde thy handes commende ſoule thou haſte redeemed mee thou arte ſoothfaſt thou wilt continue thy goodneſſe towardes mee euen end euen ſo lorde therefore prouide thou daungers faithfull hauing called thus vppon god doo truſte hee heare therefore call vpon without ceaſsing although perceyue helpeth yet notwithſtanding hold ſtill courſe warranting themſelues theyr welfare aſſured bycauſe grounded vppon god truth infallible vnchaungeable yee ſee laughing whereof mention made ment god child ſhould become altogither ſenſeleſſe conceyue nothing ſhould make ſport god thretneth aduerſitie manlineſſe rather beaſtlineſſe child god muſte bee afrayde ſpecially perceyue god viſiteth ſinnes muſte thinke thoroughly yea muſte haue feeling miſeries neighbour pitie yet therewithall ſhall alſo laugh ſay ſhall bee able deſpiſe aduerſities according wee ſee howe sainct paule ſpeaketh triumpheth againſt pouertie againſte diſeaſes againſt hunger thirſt ſword thing preſent thing come yea ſpecially cace concerned fighting againſt power aboue wherefore wee know god hath taken v keeping hee bee ſhielde wee may defie harmes come v menne ſucceſsiuely ſayde faithfull man ſhall viſit tente ſhall meete wyth miſhappe greeue ſhall ſee linage increaſed breede cattell ſhall bee bliſſed god heerein ſhewed vnto v god ſhew loue whiche beareth v contented remedie miſhappes delyuer v alſo bliſſeth v diuers ſortes maketh v proſper intent wee ſhoulde feele hys grace vpon v thus yee ſee ſumme conteyned heere haue neede conſider god goodneſſe thoroughly bycauſe ſuccoreth v affliction ſo ſide benefites beſtoweth vpon v behoueth v bee attentiue knowe fatherly care whiche hee hath v ſpecially ſoeuer ſhall take v worlde wee may knowe holie ghoſt ſheweth v heere according ſhall ſet foorthe anon finally caces reſpectes god bee guyder thoſe although fayne indure thing thys mortall lyfe ſubiecte many chaunges ouerturnings yet god wyll preſerue bliſsing bee ſufficient defende euen ende yee ſee holye ghoſt ment ſhewe v heere mouth eliphas among grace whiche lorde promiſeth vnto men whereby bee knowen bee gentle louing one gyueth v child wee knowe howe linage ſingular honor whyche god doeth vnto men verily hee haue hys goodneſſe knowne euen reſpecte beaſtes beaſtes doo thriue increace god ſay haue goodneſſe fauour caught hold thereby bee done createth child formeth owne image excellent greater dignitie man nature creature maruell though god doo ſo often holy scripture marke ſayde bliſsing precious thing way men afflicted child lette vnderſtande ſame proceedeth ſinne god order reuerſed cace neuerthe leſſe wee maye manifeſtly perceyue god could tell world howe vtter loue beareth v great goodneſſe towardes v better giuing v iſſue finally ſayde faithfull man ſhall gathered graue ſtacke corne gathered togither due time layde berne alſo man ſhall come thither abundance ſay hee ſhall haue liued fill heere eliphas meant ſay god wyll preſerue hys ſeruantes violent death guyde ſuche ſorte worlde ſoeuer muſt depart ſhall man gathered corne harueſt time better corne ſhoulde bee layde intoo berne ſhoulde periſhe fieldes leaue corne ſtanding fielde dead ripe▪ graynes muſt needes ſhedde come naught birdes eate ſome reſte muſte rotte troden intoo dirte bee gathered intoo berne man may applye good vſe eliphas promiſeth god hath made faithfull bring foorth fruite world ſhall come full rypeneſſe gather vp himſelfe menne gather corne true hee doth thus alwayes wee ſee ſometimes god ſuffereth ſeruantes fall violent death plucketh worlde floure age yea euen infancie vvee ſee cain came greate yeeres age abell raught away ſworde meant god preſerue faithfull one euen till bee full rype man ſhoulde gather corne berne wee muſt marke firſt holy scripture ſpeaketh theſe worldly bliſſinges intendeth falleth ſo commonly falleth ſo continually furthermore wee muſte make compariſon betweene greater benefyte leſſer vvhen god ſuffereth child bee taken worlde betymes▪ profyte god prouideth better faithfull man hee calleth age twentie thirtie yeeres hee letteth liue till threeſcore ſpecially wee ſee worlde flowing intoo ſuche corruption confounded nowe dayes praye ought wee eſteeme happie god hath drawen away himſelfe longer time languiſhe heere miracle menne coulde continue heere come al olde age wee ſee ſnares satan layeth v howe right harde walke ſo many outrage therefore god pull away child quickly lette v bee ſure dooth greater benefite ſpecially wee haue herevppon vnderſtand although bee bereft bliſsing whyche ſmall reſpect god wyll gyue yet dothe ceaſſe loue fauoure ſuffering fall ſo ſpeedie death lyke thoſe perſecuted tyrantes haue moſte precious deathe offer vp ſacrifize whyche moſte acceptable god offering ſweete ſauour hee ſeeth hys woorde ſealed vp bloud martyr wee compare leſſe greater wee ſhall finde promiſſe feeling continually ſayde bliſsing god ſending gra • e corne gathered due time vayne towardes faithfull ſoeuer world go rypeneth continually faythfull man die age thirtie yeeres doth ſeemeth greatly ſorie hee maketh great ſtruggeling againſt wee ſee vnbeleeuers yea bee euen ſtale earth prouerbe ſayeth beholde deſpizer god worldling whych neuer thought vppon death commeth poynte god pinche good earneſt make grinde teethe frette hymſelfe weening withſtande death ſaying prolong lyfe one yeere longer take hymſelfe bee peece greene woode crackleth ſides contrariwiſe faythfull perſone dieth although indure muche yet hee betaketh hymſelfe vntoo god comforteth hymſelfe hym although bee ſtriuing ſeene body yet hath hee mynde quiet deſireth nothing frame himſelfe god good choozing rather dye god calleth liue heere ſhorte deſireth nothing obey good heauenly father vve ſee howe god dothe alwayes rypen hys ſeruants call worlde ſo bee fully ſatisfyed come graues hee bringeth twentie yeeres graue rype another ſhall bring ye would ſay million yeeres according ſee vnbeleeuers fret chafe themſelues againſt god calleth ſo bee neuer rype olde ynough let v marke god bereeueth child thing hee promiſeth texte witte ſoeuer worlde go ſhall come graue lyke corne ripe meete applyed good vſe therefore let euery one v bee contented god hath giuen grace liue worlde ſeeing haue recorde conſciences verely hee drawe v himſelfe although pleaſe keepe v worlde time exerciſe v many affliction miſeries yet let v ceaſſe taſte continually goodneſſe maketh v feele ſo many wayes whereof ſhall haue full fruition preſent lyfe hee ſhal haue called v eternall reſt hath prepared v purchaſed v death paſsion lorde ieſus chriſt let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying giue v grace walking ſo many daungers wee may knowe howe oure ſinnes cauſe wee haue neede bee ſo beaten chaſtized hande therewithall let v pray graunt v grace correction hee ſendeth v maye bee vnprofitable v may learne feare iuſtice ſo may bee earneſter call vpon neceſsities alſo giue v grace walke togither one right brotherhoode thereby ſhewe howe wee rightly child ſeeke nothing knitte ſelues togither goodneſſe whereas ſee vnbeleeuers conſpyre deſpiſe god right reaſon may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo al people nation earth c xxiij sermon first vpon ſixth chapter 1 iob anſvvered ſayde vnto 2 diſtreſſe vvere vvell vveyed ſorovves vere put balance 3 vvould heauier ſand sea vvherefore vvordes ſvvallovved vp 4 arrovves almightie mee vvhereof poyſon drinketh vp ſpirite terrours god directed agaynſt mee 5 vvill vvilde aſſe bray vvhen hath graſſe vvill oxe lovve vvhen hath fodder 6 shall vvhich vnſauerie bee eaten vvithoute salte taſte vvhite egge 7 thing vvhich ſoule hath lothed touch vvere diſeaſe fleſh 8 thing vvhich deſire might happen mee thing vvhich loue vvere graunted mee 9 god vvould cruſhe breake vvould cut mee abovve wee haue conſider ſtate poore man god ſcourgeth maketh feele ſuche miſery may ſeeme hee hath god againſt vve ſee power mē hold whē cace ſo verye true iob neuer yet vtterly ouerthrowne ſo ſhoulde haue pacience yet notwithſtanding without much difficultie could gather wit haue ſome comfort way haue ſayd wee haue behold anguiſh mortal man whē god ſheweth himſelfe aduerſarie partie greatly behoofe mind leſſon bicauſe ouer negligent yea ouerfewe thinke vpon kinde temptation bee ſpoken ſuffering miſerie▪ pacient aduerſitie bee fleſhly mount higher ſenſualtie able comprehend ſay may indure diſeaſes may bee put ſome trouble may happen vnto v greateſt miſchiefe whiche able ouerwhelme men vtterly god preſſeth maketh feele wrath hee bent full againſt ſay haue ye offended ſo therefore god ſheweth himſelf ſo ſore againſt men behold temptatiō paſſeth euer may indure bodie ye ſee ſaide good trie thing throughly conteyned iob ſayth would faine diſtreſſe well weyed ſide ſorrowes greefes wit miſerie indureth ſuffereth put togither balance ſayth ſhould ſeene miſerie mine heauier ſand ſea proof hereof god hath ſhot arrowes yea euē poyſoned arrowes ſo much fired ſpirit ſwallowed vp ſpirite ſteeped bitterneſſe reaſon god ſayde arrowes haue pearced mee beholde whereat hee beginneth ſeemeth heere hee frameth vniuſt complaynt hee ſayeth miſerie ſo great ſorrowe bee able match bee anſwerable thys complaynt draweth neere cain made wee knowe without blaſphemie ſoone cain heard condemnation whiche god pronounced agaynſt certaine hee could iuſtifie himſelfe ſinne manifeſt hee conuinced accuſed god crueltie ouergreat rigour puniſhment ſayth ouergreat able beare thou wilt chaſe ouer earth able ſtande thy face howe doeſt thou handle mee wee ſee heere although wretched caytife coulde denie puniſhed iuſtly yet notwithſtanding ſtartinghole god puniſhed vprightly paſſed meaſure rigorouſneſſe againſt ſayd ſeemeth iob doth like ſayth maruell though bee great diſtreſſe bicauſe affliction indureth exceeding great much heauie ſhould ſay could lament ynough ſeeing god handled ſo roughly haue ſeene hath come already euen curſing byrthday howe woulde bin borne dead ſo hee alſo banneth day wherein borne ſeemeth iob might bee excuſed deede haue tolde alreadie although haue good cace yet doth handle amiſſe behoueth men know howe ſome faultineſſe reſpect neuertheleſſe ceaſſeth ſpeake truth hee ſayeth miſerie whiche hee indureth ſo great ſo extreeme euen woordes ſwallowed vp ſo muche behalfe hee man ouerwhelmed whiche hath liuelyneſſe ſo euer able ſaye nothing compariſon affliction wherewith god preſſeth lette v marke therefore wee haue two thing one wee ſee poore ſillie creature god preſſeth wyth iudgement haue ſayde alreadie wee ſhoulde knowe fighting agaynſt temptation although wee doo beſt wee withſtande ſubmitte ſelues vnto god yet notwithſtanding wee ſwaye aſide eyther one waye infirmitie ſo neuer ſufficient ſtrength v except god holde v vp ſuffer v bow ſo expedient v know bee made ſteele wee bee rockes ſtone mortall men full frailtie behoofefull god ſhoulde make v feele alſo although aſsiſt v affliction ſo ouercome yet doth make v woūded halte ſay leaueth alwayes ſome feebleneſſe v ſheweth ſelfe mightie operation giueth v thus ye ſee two point haue conſider firſt let v call remembrance haue touched heretofore wee bee tempted whenſoeuer bee pinched aduerſitie bodie wee muſte feare ſtill ſpirituall temptation god cyteth v iudgement becommeth iudge ſo wee muſt bee faine anſwere render accounte true wee ſhal much perceiue thing toucheth v fleſhe ſo wee bee wholly giuen wee ſee commonly menne feare famine peſtilence ſickneſſe death whiche vttermoſt man threaten v wee bee afrayde man ſpeake v god wee bee moued whit ſo herein ſhewe ſelues bee dull yea euen vttermoſt differ nothing ox aſſes wee make ſo ſmall reckening god wrath damnation prepared ſoules meane continue enemy vnto god man talke v thing concerneth preſent life wee amazed meaſure neuertheleſſe meane time whyle continue dulneſſe god ceaſſeth exerciſe thoſe ſuch maner maketh feele wrath ſayde bee tempted muche without compariſon indured miſeries poſsible bee imagined sometimes wee ſhall thinke ſtraunge faythfull ſhould ſpeake thus god hath ſhewed himſelfe lion towards hath broken bone burning fire wote become ſoule ſwallowed vp bodie good rotten nothing ſtinch vvherefore faythfull ſpeake ſo ſeemeth bee nice womaniſhe yet notwithſtanding theſe moſt ſtrong ſtedfaſt whome haue ſeene gouerned ſpirite god ſo haue inuincible courage dauid goodly pacience god exercyſed verie much yet ſee alwayes vpper hande ſo neuer caryed away vnto wickedneſſe trouble befell ye ſee man armes hath bene practiſed maner battayles onely day yeare lyfe long yet experience complayneth hee neuer beene acquainted aduerſitie wiſt afflicted yea verely haue ſayde let v marke preſſed bodily harmes although ſenſible men yet greatly grieued beare ſickneſſe ſuffer ſuch like thing vvhat driueth complaine ſo bycauſe hee entereth hymſelfe touched conſcience though god onely forſaken alſo become deadly foe purſued euen vnto hell ſay thou ſhalt haue neyther peace truce drowne thee altogither seeing dauid ſo preſſed wyth feeling ſinnes perceyued god wrath kindled agaynſt yee ſee nipped euen heart ezechias felte muche god onely afflicted ſickneſſe may commonly befall vnto v alſo beſides ſhewed token diſpleaſure therefore ſeemed vntoo god woulde repeale diſanull grace hee graunted deathe ſhoulde cauſe god ſeruice bee quite ouerthrowne beene ſtabliſhed hande vvhen ezechias conceyued ſo great ſo horrible vengeance god good reaſon hee ſhoulde ſo diſmayde ſo yee ſee hee made ſuch complaynts ar conteyned ſong therefore let v marke god afflicteth v body wee well take paciently miſeryes hee ſendeth v nothing compariſon anguiſhe whiche indure maketh feele wrath vengeance yet notwithſtanding profite come therevnto although ſo harde bitter thing vntoo v yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt bee fayne come ſo conceyue theyr bodily tribulation paſſe ſeeke helpe diſeaſes theyr ſoules bycauſe perceyue ſo conſequently paſſe ſeeke attonement god conſider iuſtice ſayde neceſſarie v wounded god iudgement wee haue taken holde may bee conſtrayned grone vnder ſuch anguiſhe according wee ſee haue beene iob true euerye man ſhall haue like meaſure god alſo knoweth wee bee able beare according man ſhall bee weake god ſhall haue indued ſo great grace holy ſpirite ſo verily hee make feele iudgement thereafter howbeeit hee holde vp make taſte mercie middes wrath ſo ſame ſhall vtterly diſmay hath receyued ſingular ſtrength whome god hath fortified holy ſpirite muſt faine ſuſtaine greater brunt farre rougher aſſaults ſuch feeble like litle child ye perceiue ſee theſe ſpirituall battayles dauid ezechias iob neuer one v ſhall finde himſelfe true ſhall haue portion haue ſayde without would become dullard woulde ſigne forſaken god ſo ſhould haue conſciences rocked aſleepe much god preſſeth v iudgement ſmall wee compare ſelues holy perſons haue incountred agaynſt ſorrowes death hell ſo god armed yea hee ſo fenced owne ſtrength although bowed yet vtterly beaten downe beaten downe yet god lift vp againe therefore behoueth v marke well ſayde vnto v furthermore ſee iob ſo ſore preſſed euen iob ſay mirrour pacience let v learne walke aduiſedly happened greene tree ſhall become drie tree vve ſee iob ſo hartburned anguiſh wee ſee ſo dulled torment wiſt ſpeake ſhall become v god liſt ſcourge v rigorouſly muſt needes quaile vtterly muſt aſtonie v neuertheleſſe ſtandeth v hande bee afrayde hardie ynough bee farre blowes ordinarie maner inſomuch none v make himſelfe valiant ſeemeth nothing ſhall able daunt v let v rather conſider feebleneſſe end may puffed vp vaine preſumption may vnderſtande poore creature cannot well hold one minute houre agaynſt aſſaults may giuen v either ſyde except flee god praying ſtrengthen v ye ſee haue wee beholde example iob moreouer let v marke well woorde hee ſayth arrowes god venim hath drunke vp ſpirite ſpirite hath ſucked venim eyther wayes may ſpoken principall poynt haue marke iob doth v vnderſtande heere hath deale men cace ſtandeth indure ſome affliction fleſh knowe ſayth god warreth agaynſt onely ſo arrowes alſo ſayth mee haue ſtryken mee heart runne quite firſt place iob ſheweth faine indure battayles god himſelfe warred agaynſt matter mortall man thing nothing ſhould bee forced ſo farre feele god prepareth bendeth himſelfe agaynſt yet notwithſtanding able outſtande howe ſhould bee poſsible neuertheleſſe haue ſayde alreadie muſt needes brought poynt owne profite good ſooth profite euil vnder god ſcourges meane wee beate braynes reaſon men ſee whence aduerſities come vnto v linger ſtill verie yll conſidered v example one diſeaſed thinke himſelfe ſuch inconuenience light vpon lo ſuch thing cauſe hee cannot ſuffer affliction whereby god ſhall giue occaſion feele wrath man farre receyuing frute chaſtizementes god ſendeth ſay wee ceaſſe alledge hold ſelues ſtill creature profite verie yll therefore muſt mount vp ſtep aduerſities come god come vpon v bicauſe ſinnes heerewithall let v vnderſtande howe much god ſhotte arrowes v wounded v let v bethinke v well woorde iob ſayeth arrowes almightie let flee agaynſt yea hee ſayeth expreſly ſticke faſt ſpirit ſwallowed vp vvhere hee meeneth diſtreſſe commeth ſayde fearing god according alſo hee addeth terrours god bent agaynſte better vnderſtanding ſtreyne let v marke god dooth oftentimes afflict thoſe wylfull hard hearted mynde neuer humbled beate backe god iudgements anuylde beateth backe hammer god woundeth liſteth meeneth humble inſomuch ſtryken quite yea euen bottome hart thus yee ſee iob ment expreſſe true ſomtimes like ſhall happen reprobate alſo full account made ſpeciall grace god beſtoweth vpon child pearceth ſo throughout maketh feele vengeance within hart ſuch wiſe ſwallowed vp harte conſumed hard v flee poſsible thereby god worketh welfare much better ſhould ſo th •• ſhoulde blockiſh beate backe conceytes god ſendeth v whē purpoſeth ſcourge v ſinnes make v feele howe terrible thing haue agaynſt v beholde muſt profite ſelues ſuch wounding knowing god intendeth humble v ende ſhould bee ſcorners doo nothing mocke iudgements hys making v feele quicke ende wee ſhoulde quake furthermore wee ſee neede haue ſuch medicine ſith bee ſuche dullard follow luſtes fleſh better god worde wee moued threatnings made v ſeemeth would hold owne agaynſt god ſpite defiance beholde pride ſeene commonly men alſo ſhould ſubiect therevnto god clenzeth v ſhewing himſelf ſo rough towarde v might feele arrowes hart courage might ſwallowed vp likewiſe iob ſayth terror god directed leuelled ſo wordes ſwallowed vp conſumed vvhereas hee ſayth terribleneſſe god leueled meeneth haue ſayd alreadie hath men enemyes god himſelfe warreth againſt true may aſſaulted men handes yet notwithſtanding wee muſt ceaſſe acknowledge ſayde heere wit god armeth creature agaynſt v ende ſhewe v diſpleaſure worde ſide ſoeuer miſchiefe threaten iob yea euen wounded muſt acknowledge howe hande god toucheth preſſeth cauſe ſaith terrours terribleneſſe hee knowes well ynough whē god ſcourgeth int •• haue returne vnto god ſeeketh nothing receyue ſeruants mercie deliuer trouble indure theſe ſorowes ſuffreth able take hold goodneſſe god intendeth vſe towards thus ye ſee cauſe impacience euen touched requiſite render god due honour proofe hereof ſpeake calling vpon god deſiring haue pitie vpon v ceremonially vntill knowe laſt caſt poore damned ſoules forlorne creature vntill knowe throughly quicke certaine oure deſiring god haue pitie vpon v ſhall teeth outwarde therefore man neuer honoureth god good earneſt vnleſſe hee bee confounded himſelfe matter conſiſteth altogither ſaying god muſt bee ſuperior ouer v wee ſubiect creature wee muſte yeelde honour ſpecified namely righteous nothing elſe v maner wickedneſſe ende wee may haue mouth ſhette bee diſtitute excuſe ſo wee maye make account ſelues acknowledge nothing belongeth v ſhame deſerue caſt away ſtin •• ng curſed creature bee come poynt honouring ſeruing god according saint paule ſheweth thirde romaine ſpeaking god infinite glorie hee ſayeth becommeth v come ſuch feare lowlineſſe wee may bee lyke poore offender halter neckes ſo ſhoulde go hell hee plucked v backe infinit goodneſſe without cauſe god afflicteth ſeruants preſſeth ſuch wiſe hee bringeth poynt ende hee may bee gloryfied touching ſayth wordes ſwallowed vp much ſayd ſpeaketh rhetorically wee ſee ſome men eloquent ſetting aduerſities thoſe cokneys indure little aduerſitie neede man lawe pleade caſe ſeemeth heare ſpeak none men ſhoulde haue compaſsion ſo well pleade babble ſhewe well ynough aduerſitie ſo greatly greeue beene touched good earneſt certaine woulde ſhewe ſayde heere heere ye ſee wherfore expreſly ſayde ſong ezechias hee chattered like swallowes hee voice man vtter conceyt beene ſo ſhet vp time ſorow wiſt ſay howe couch wordes vtter hys mynde let v marke god ſummoneth ſeruaunts ſuche wiſe hee ſheweth himſelfe bee iudge pincheth quicke euen deſtitute wordes confounded know howe expreſſe meenings although ſay god woorke ſo hee oftentymes deale roughly v yet notwithſtanding let v call mind conuenient remedie leaſt wee bee put vtter confuſion sainct paule meeneth hee ſayeth god holye ſpirite gyueth v gronings intollerable vvhen sainct paule ſpeaketh prayer faythfull meene better ſort hee ſayeth god maketh v pray earneſtly wee grone yea wee euen grone wee haue woorde hande man ſhoulde demaunde v thou ſayeſt vvhat thou deſireſt god vve wiſt ſay vvee muſte keepe thing locked vp ſo wee cannot declare woorde mouth wee ment ſay yee ſee howe god remedyeth whiche ſpoken heere although oure ſpeeche ſwallowed vp yet hee giueth v meane finde get meane hee alloweth although kinde language vnderſtoode men yea euen partie himſelfe prayeth vntoo god bee intangled ſo hee cannot vtter woordes yet doth god vnderſtand ſuch maner ſpeech nowe foraſmuche wee ſee god heareth gronings wee bee ſo abaſhed wee bee vtterly diſmayde ſelues let v beare paciently aduerſities hee ſendeth v ſeeing hee giueth ſuch ſucceſſe redoundeth profite welfare lo haue marke vpon ſtraine heere withall iob vſeth certaine ſimilitudes ſhewe howe without cauſe hee complayneth ſo hee ſayeth wylde aſſe bray hee hathe graſſe wil oxe hee hath fodder furthermore man eate thing hath ſauour •• white egge without ſalt ſuch ſimilitudes iob meeneth menne beaſtes glad thing fall oute theyr minde deſire▪ vvhat thing wilde aſſe ſeeketh hee deſyreth paſture therefore hath graſſe careth bray greeue himſelfe vvhy ſo hath thing hee deſireth oxe likewiſe contented hath fodder giuen contrarywiſe ſayth howe poſsible man ſhould made like thing agaynſt verely wee eate meates vnſauerie man ſhoulde make v ſuppe white egge ynough make v ſpewe thing woulde go agaynſt ſtomacke seeing worde betokeneth vnſauerie thing ſayd bitter thing ſhoulde ſerue choke v yet much worſe miſeries wherewith iob afflicted therefore concludeth therevpon woulde fayne haue owne wiſhe god woulde kill first blow make pine away ſort yee ſee effect ment heere firſt let v marke ſentence good true yea doctrine conteyned therein verie profitable expedient v bee warned paſsions ſtande much vpon reputation owne vertues therefore good v knowe haue neede haue fleſhly deſires repreſſed vvhy ſo ende thing fall oute according mynde wee may haue skill ſay beholde god giueth v heartes deſire therefore wee haue whereof reioyce thing fall agaynſt v wee maye acknowledge ſay beholde god afflicteth v vvherefore euen bicauſe haue offended hee cut v oute morſelles good therefore theſe thing ſhoulde bee knowne vnto v wee ſhould minde remembrance ſhould oftentymes bee renued ſpeciallye great ſhame men haue diſcretion ſeeing brute beaſtes ſhew howe according meaſure haue ſome diſcretion true reaſon iudgement oxe aſſe yet hath god giuen certaine witte whiche leadeth thither nature goeth nowe let v conſider god giueth vnto man ought haue iudgement bycauſe ſpirite imprinted ſoule behoueth haue diſcretion yet let v note behoueth v ineſpecially fight agaynſt oure luſtes howe ſo aſſe leaue hys braying hee hath paſture afore ſo man content himſelfe verie well good man ſhoulde thanke god hath proſperitie ſhoulde know ſo much beholding god muſt fal aſleepe vpon let v learne two thing one god giueth v meate drinke worſe brute beaſtes wee make account ſuch libertie ſo blockiſh harte wee conſider howe liberall gracious god towardes v thus much firſt poynt wee conceyue cleane cōtrary many men yea maner al men howe great vnthankefulneſſe god giue v meate drinke haue ſtayedneſſe brute beaſtes holde ſelues quiet contented like vnſatiable seagulles fowle howe exceſsiue appetite see howe aſſe eateth although haue trauelled great paine put paſture ſatiſfieth himſelfe layes vpon contented man though haue crammed much foure fiue men could ſwall owe vp contented hee regardeth meete ſtill bee heaping vp gathering vvhen man hath garner full yet hath bellie bigge vvhen hath wine ſeller well ſtored thinketh nothing vvhen hath prouiſion ynough whole doozen perſons yet contented like 〈◊〉 neuer filled ye ſee men 〈◊〉 away luſtes ſo neuer ſatiſfied ſuch vnthankfulneſſe iudge muſt ſuch maner folk haue euen aſſes •• en angelles neede come downe heauen poure god condemnation vpon head order nature man may perceyue much reaſon modeſtie dulneſſe theſe beaſts thā men ought haue conſideration beholde ſpeciall poynt haue marke ſide alſo let v learne wee muſt bee lyke brute beaſts ſeeking nothing elſe bellie cheere god ſendeth v proſperitie muſt holde v muſt butte ſhoote vvhat let v vſe ſayde proſperitie paſsing continually ſtill preparing ſelues affliction god liſt ſende v intent bee taken vnwares bycauſe wee made reckening haue lyued alwayes eaſe ſay let v beware wee fall aſleepe ſuche careleſneſſe god ſendeth v paſture wee bee handeled well wee woulde wiſhe let v continually quicken vppe ourſelues wee may attayne benefyte wherevntoo hee calleth v marke ſpeciall poynt nowe whereas ſayde wee cannot bee made eate whiche • without ſauour wee cannot ſuppe white egge without ſalt heereby wee may knowe haue ſayde howe blowe come good forethinke oure ſelues colde heate vnſauerie vittayles ſuch thing aduerſities ſhunne nature verie well needes muſt wee feele geere wee bee ſenfeleſſe howſoeuer worlde go let v make ſelues readie indure paciently thing vnſauerie let v bee contented god ſhall profite therewithall let v aſſure ſelues ſithe hee ordeyneth onely muſte bee better taſte vnto v thing happen v oure owne good vvhat ſhall ſalt make v finde good taſte aduerſities befall v ſo wee maye beare paciently obedience ſo wee acknowledge ſay go ſee heere howe god afflicteth v firſt bycauſe worthie ſecondly bicauſe aduaunce welfare meane beholde ſay make v finde good ſauour heeretofore ye would ſay lothſome poynt muſt come vnto deſirous finde fauour aduerſities may paciently receyue correction whiche ſhall pleaſe god ſende v wee may frame ſelues good pleaſure deſiring nothing accompliſh hath begonne intent beeing guided gouerned holye ſpirite may ſeeke nothing loue ſerue honour holde good rightfull ſhall pleaſe ſende v nowe let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledging fault praying make v perceyue better haue done hitherto ſhall pleaſe make v feele iudgements although preſſed meaſure owne ſeeming yet notwithſtanding may ceaſſe reſort vnto continually hoping deliuer v al aduerſities according infinite mercie reach hande v continually although firſt wee perceyue minded ayde v yet may wayt paciently till time conuenient come ſhewe v hath alwayes beene freendly fauourable v yea truly meane lorde ieſus chriſt according hath pleaſed chooze v call v knowledge ende make v member bodie may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people c xxiiij sermon ſecond vpon ſixt chapter 8 vvho vvill cauſe deſire come paſſe god may ſende longing 9 vvhich hee ſhoulde breake mee peeces ſhoulde ſtretch hande cut mee 10 ſhould yet haue comfort ſhoulde reioyce griefe let ſpare vvill denie vvordes holy one 11 vvhat ſtrength ſhoulde bee able indure vvhat mine ende ſhould prolong life 12 ſtrength ſtrength ſtones fleſh ſteele 13 might fayleth mee 14 hee afflicted ought haue good turne friende men haue forſaken feare almightie god wee haue goe forwarde matter began alreadie iob tormenteth ſelfe heere miſerie hee indureth bodie bycauſe god hilde poore condemned perſon bycauſe hee dealeth iudge altogither againſt ye ſee wherefore iob greeued reſt hee coulde ſuffer wit bycauſe feeleth god hande heauie vppon dauid ſpeaketh two thirtie pſalme let v marke well alwayes otherwiſe ſhall knowe purpoſe hee ſayeth woulde deade would god woulde kill mee would cut world ſhoulde haue ſome eaſe ſhoulde bee ſo ſore preſſed coulde befall worſe thing death ſpecially death god ſending wherein ſhould knowe god woulde vtterly ouerwhelme extremeſt miſeries yet hee ſayth god woulde diſpatch one blowe could well beare linger pyning hee doth bee preſſed ſo long hee ſayth impoſsible keepe meaſure one hee hilde burning fire let v marke well diuerſitie whiche betweene man ouerwhelmed firſt ſtroke another god holdeth vpon rack ſcourgeth long without giuing hym reſpite releeued miſerie muſt faine abyde continually let v nowe come ripping vp cace iob pleadeth firſt hee ſheweth cheefe deſire ſhoulde die cut true haue touched heeretofore god child may well wiſhe death howbeit ende reſpect hee doth heere like v muſt paule deſire let looce bondage ſinne wherin hilde priſoners saint paule mooued temptation fleſhe rather deſire hee hath imploy himſelfe god ſeruice without let driueth wiſhe might paſſe priſon bodie vvhy ſo ſo long wee bee worlde muſt alwayes wrapped many miſeries wee ceaſſe offende god beeing ſo weake wee bee saint paule ſorie hee muſt liue ſo long offending god kinde deſire good holy proceedeth holy ghoſt verie fewe deſire go worlde reſpect ſo long bee eaſe care whit vyces imperfection haue ſo forwarde ſeruing god requiſite geere toucheth v whit vvhat betide v trouble fall diſeaſe matter fal would haue wee wiſh ſelues worlde none talke oure wearineſſe deſpizing oure lyfe yee ſee iobs wiſhing chiefly bycauſe hee knewe ſtate bicauſe miſerie hee felt nippe therefore hee deſirous haue requeſt god hande onely deſireth hart alſo addreſſeth himſelfe god make ſute yet another miſchiefe man wiſshing death iob doth heere ſhall bee ye woulde ſay ſhet vp ſhrunke himſelfe ſo ſhall dare preſent himſelfe vnto god pray though ſo haue cōmitted great offence muſt preſume hide ſelues haue backe nookes wherein make wiſshes wicked reiected god yet man ſhall come ſo farre forth make ſuch requeſt vnto god doubt ſinneth double vvhy ſo ouergreat raſhneſſe v come vnhallow name god wee muſt pray vvhat rule muſt obſerue behalfe requeſt nothing agreeable hys wil according iohn ſpeaketh canonical epiſtle verely lorde ieſus chriſt ſheweth full well muſt keepe ſayd modeſtie ſetteth downe petition god done ye ſee iob vnhalloweth name god dareth make ſuch ſo exceſsiue requeſt nowe firſt poynt whereas lawfull men wiſhe god woulde deliuer quickly mortall bodie life beſieged ſo many wantes miſeries reaſon trouble muſt indure bicauſe alwayes ſubiect many vice marke ſpeciall poynt let v marke god afflicteth v happen thing ſowre v muſt wiſh death therfore rather wee muſt buckle ſelues combate ſith god ſo thirdly deſire bee ſet free bondage ſinne god ſhoulde breake bondes holde v nowe let men meaſurably ſo may readie bee humbled muche ſhall pleaſe although greeue v ſighe bicauſe wee cannot giue ſelues wholly god commaundeth wee muſt firſt haue cōſideration ſay vvell lord thy beeing poore ſinner hauing vice continually lurking ſhoulde ſerue thee graunt mee grace acknowledge faultes may ſigh thee craue pardon thy hande beholde ſay meaſure behoueth v keepe furthermore let v learne example iob wee come god v bring thither oure owne deſires owne luſtes ſpeake whatſoeuer commeth tung ende requeſtes muſt alwayes bee framed according god promiſes according giueth v leaue demaunde ye ſee whereat muſt begin wee pray vnto god becommeth v muſt raſh threape hande wee muſt conſider well lawfull v according honour thoſe yeelde vnto god craue whatſoeuer commeth minde without foreconſideration meening haue head vnder gyrdle beholde ſay vntollerable preſumptuouſneſſe mortall man beare ſuche ſway god muſt bee ſubiect demaundes beſides haue ſhewed alreadie god wil haue v yeeld ſuch reuerence ſeeke know hee giueth v leaue thinketh good haue v modeſtie seeing iob hath happened ouerſhoote himſelfe ſo farre make ſuch requeſt vnto god naughty ſelues would finde fault let v well aduiſed bee ſober minded fall hand praying vnto god haue wel conſidered aforehand thing god promiſeth permitteth way remedie hereof ſhould pray vnto god whē fleſh prouoketh v deſire ſome mantel thē peruerting true prayer demaund thing god hath allowed ſay ſome anſwere verie wel ſir pray god ſhoulde diſpleaſe ſhould make ſubiect ſort deſires may wel ynough wiſh yet mynded god ſhould ſubiect deſires muſt vſe ſuch leapes vvhat done then▪ vvhen ſee ſuch wiſhes ſo fooliſh full vanitie onely fonde alſo wicked bee done ſeeking lurking hole vvhat let v rather lay open harte god holy scripture ſpeaketh therof ſo haue nothing wrapped vp ſoone deſire come mynde let v thinke thus lawfull wiſh ſuch thing doth god permit let v fall examining oure ſelues thing entred intoo heart may layde open haue made god priuie let v diſpoſe ſelues pray vnto according vvhen haue ſo done let v part conſider wee muſt come vnto god heade vpright bee ſo bolde make ſo farre account ſhoulde whatſoeuer wee haue conceyued oure braine wee muſt bee ſubiect poyntes reſpectes nowe wee holde v meaſure yee ſhall ſee oure euill luſtes corrected repreſſed knowing man muſte couet thing might bolde aske god hande bee brydle v wee muſt preſume aske anye thing whiche god hath graunted hys woorde bee ſo wee muſt needes bee reſtrayned fleſh muſt ouermayſter v carie v away lo wee haue marke concerning iob ſtreyne yet notwithſtanding leſſon verie ſlenderly practized worlde wee ſee howe one ſorte make wiſhes without ſubmitting vnto god another ſort ſuche vaine fantaſticall myndes deſyre contraryes none conceyte coyning framing newe deuiſes heade neuer pray vntoo god beholde heere intollerable vyce howe ſo men wander awaye ſo whereas god allureth familiarly come vntoo whereas hee telleth may bee vnburthened caſting care vpon great wilfull frowardneſſe men make themſelues ſuche ſtraungers drawe backe yet notwythſtanding ordinarie matter let euerie man ſearche himſelfe pray howe many fooliſhe deſyres haue wee v whiche mooue v ſighe oure ſelues although god priuie another ſort ſwarue aſide contrarie extremitie become like blockes god asking without knowing howe without hauing rule choyce hereby bee ſeene ſayde leſſon whiche haue earſt ſet afore verie yll knowne onely thoſe haue beene inſtructed god woorde alſo v therefore ſo much better muſt wee marke text ende euery v may holde himſelfe awe learne frame deſires better haue done bring paſſe muſt lay open god aſſuring ſelues ſhall win nothing ſlinking aſide thing muſt come account time therfore oft ſhall prouoked minded deſire thing let v learne poynt god may alwayes made priuie hereof let v examine well al ſinnes may condemne whatſoeuer ſee agreeing ought haue whole dominion ouer v let v come backe againe iob ſaith wiſh god ſhould ſlea ſtretch hande cut haue alreadie briefly ſhewed whereto theſe wordes tende wit god ſhould one ſtroke quite diſpatch man without making linger yea gayneth hee shall man fare better yea ſo ſeemes know muſt bee faine endure torment comfort v long iob hath reſpect god ſheweth himſelf iudge towards v feele agaynſt v intollerable tormēt inſomuch wee coulde finde heartes mountaynes ſhoulde fall vppon v ieſus chriſt alſo ſayth could finde harte whole worlde ſhould turned vpſide downe wee much leuer creature roſe vp agaynſt v euery ſhould bring bane paſſe infinite daungers ſo might come face god ſo dreadfull agaynſt v ye ſee whereat iob eye true knowne many vvhy ſo bicauſe part ſo blockiſh nothing elſe hardeneſſe ſtubborneſſe man woman bee pinched ſickneſſe crie ala bee pinched pouertie hunger thing euerie man complaine hath occaſion torment minde wee skill god perſecuteth v ſheweth v howe dreadfull wrath proofe heereof conſciences ſo rockt aſleepe hardly one bee founde among thouſande euer taſted ment hande god ſo terrible iob ſetteth foorth yet neuertheleſſe haue neede ſo much better fēced leſſe power againſt ſuch affliction god ſpare v time knowe keepeth v ende vve ſee many haue beene careleſſe haue made good cheere tyme life yea euen men haue laboured make feele god iudgemēt haue turned mockage whoſe iolitie god hath ſo abated drewe towarde death inſteade ieſting ſporting wherevnto bene giuen haue bene faine feele terror hell ye would ſay locked vp yea vtterly ouerwhelmed thē bicauſe god caſt lightning vpon ſay ſhal ſee ſome come ſtate ſo god puniſheth pride wherewith puffed vp conceyt greeue therfore ſcripture ſpeaketh v dreadfulneſſe conceyue feele god iudge let v learne ende euery v ſhould thinke vpon certainly bodily harmes wey much v according wholy giuen fleſh preſent life beholde scripture ſpeaketh v amiſchiefe farre feared ought aſtoniſh v maketh v feele ſinnes ſummoneth v appeare toucheth v much body torne peeces ſhoulde lay many miſeries vpon v poſsible sith cace ſtandeth ſo let v feare god let v thinke ſelues haue made better market ſhunne iudgement let v holde v good let euery v come obedience examining life ſuch wiſe lay account ſinnes open afore ye ſee howe wee muſt deale heare word reherſed v heere iob ſayth ſhoulde haue comfort ſhoulde warme himſelfe rather merrie ſorrow greefe hebrew worde hevſeth place ſignifieth burne warmed ſome tranſlate merrie keepe proper naturall meening worde let v take ſhoulde bee warmed ſorrow meening ſhould haue eaſe god woulde ſtretch hande cut firſt blowe greeueth pyned god vſeth force ouerwhelm miſerie might quickly bee ende yet ſurely ſo diſpatched vppon ſodaine ceaſſe afflicted ſtill eaſeth ſo farre feele great paine iob ſpeaketh like man ouerpaſsionate knoweth hee therefore ſeeming better comfort bee vtterly razed oute ſoone god layeth hand vpon vvhen wee haue preſent paſsion wee imagine none miſerie whole worlde vvhen man preſſed ſorrowe great exceſſiue hee thinketh nothing men greefes thoſe nothing heate coulde finde hart bee cooled yea euen yce yet hee bee fornummed colde ſame paſsion alſo bee greeuous beare bitter heate ſhall haue indured afore yea verily man haue eyther heate colde thing troubleth bodie yee ſhall ſee ſo ouertaken hee ſhall thinke contrarie miſeries woulde bee eaſe vntoo bycauſe paſsions carie v away lo howe iob hath ſpoken let v marke fancie releefes eaſments woulde bee ſo thoughe god ſhoulde ſende v deſyres wee ſhoulde finde wee fall one miſerie another none eaſe haue god fauourable vnto v proofe hereof pleaſe giue v pacience whē loſe finger alſo well giue v wee loſe whole hande yea euen wee ſhall bee faine loſe whole body muſte wee thinke miſerie thing ſelfe rather owne frayltie weake left vp ſelues doubt ſhall vtterly confounded god haue ſtrengthened v grace although wee haue huge mountaine beare yet ſhall well beare god power ſhall bee ynough behalfe needeth one foote water drowne man one drawe ſea therefore god reach v hand although plunged ouer heade eares yer might ſcape pleaſe deliuer v wee ſhall fayle come vtter ruine sith caſe ſtandeth ſo let v thinke haue caſe god ſhall haue chaunged kind miſerie let v aſſure ſelues wee cannot bee eaſed except god mercifull fauourable v except haue pitie vpon v ſhew v hath forgiuen ſinnes see true reſt otherwiſe muſt bee faine liue continuall vnquietneſſe like ſicke man turneth tumbleth hither thither hee thinketh hee hath ſome releefe hee bee ſuffered ſhifte one bedde another beholde owne ſeeming hee halfe whole hath toſſed turmoyled himſelfe throughly ſeeth maladie feercer vpon ſo little nothing hee mended euen ſo v ſeemeth v wee ſhould better cace god would afflict v another maner doth would neuer whit aſſwage greefe cace behoueth v flee vnto god pray withdrawe hande v hee hath receyued v mercie wee ſhall ſee ſelues rightly eaſed concerning iob ſayeth hee ſhoulde bee warmed ſorowe hee meeneth ſorow ſhould bee aſſwaged comfort like greate fyre vnder pot fleſhe bee ſodden ſoone pot throughly heated otherwiſe fleſhe wyll lie ſaping long become vnſauerie ſeemeth iob wee pine linger ſuche extremity nothing elſe make v rotte awaye oure miſeries yet neuertheleſſe haue ſayde men doo ceaſſe ſhewe themſelues vtterly deſperate witte euen god forbeareth make languiſhe behoueth v vnderſtande god liſt prolong miſeries ynough v hee giueth v pacience ſeeing hath giuen v day hee continue morrowe god woorke maner well aduerſities eaſie borne ſo plundge v ouer head eares hundred thouſande time wee alwayes remit ſelues vnto ſo hee ſuſtaine v grace hath giuen v heauen making v feele comforte holy scripture harte inſomuche god touche v whither fillip v finger ſtrike v hande whether hee gyue v greate blowes beetle whether hee make v pyne awaye peecemeale diſpatche v hande ſurely nothing ſhall happen without wiil • n • eth oure welfare ſo ſeeing wee bee child cauſe v doubte iob ſayeth let ſpare mee conceale woordes holie one hee maketh droteſtation whiche hee able perſourme hee ſpeaketh maner caryed away theyr affection behold ſayeth hee though god haue ſo ouerpreſſed firſt blowe yet condemne ſpecially grudge agaynſt rather bliſſe name confeſſe righteous neuertheleſſe ſithe tormented ſo long haue eaſe loſe pacientneſſe thereby lo howe men proceede according hath beene declared iob addeth hee ſtrength fayleth hee whiche afflicted ought haue good turne fre • ndes handes haue ſhewed alreadie iob ought haue returned vntoo god haue hilde ſelfe buckleth himſelfe agaynſt thoſe haue founde faulte temptation whereof wee ought take good heede according cauſe holye ghoſte bringeth ſtorie oure remembrance intent wee maye vnderſtande men come heaue v ſo ſcoffe v driue v diſpayre leaſtwiſe beſt driue v wee muſte take good heede going wee bee intrapped vvhy ſo beholde man commeth mee ſayes thinkeſt thou god hath care thee thou calleſt vpō thou beguyleſt thy ſelfe ſo dooing ſurely god abhorre thee thinkeſt thou would haue exerciſed thee ſuch extremitie thou ſeeſt thy ſelfe heere bee poore damned creature perceyueſt thou howe god agaynſt thee man come whet ſorte ſee deadly plague muſt warde ſpecially bycauſe haue eares beaten ſuche temptation may ſee ſay beholde diuell come ſet fire intent ſhoulde frette chafe agaynſt god muſt beate backe wile gather wittes aboute mee conſider haue deale men god therefore wee muſte put vp oure complaintes vntoo ſaye lorde thou ſeeſt howe man ſeeketh nothing driue mee deſpayre hee come hither make mee fall quite cleane away vouchſafe therefore receyue mee mercye let mee vnderſtande euer muſte indure commeth man thee alone although men bee woorkers vnaduiſedneſſe rather maliciouſneſſe craft outrage yet doth thing happen without thy thy good righteous welfare lo howe wee ought proceede iob hath miſſed poynt faulte muſte ſerue oure learning certeynly holy ghoſt hath ment verye well holy perſonage mirrour pacience ſet heere oure eye bee looked vpon intent ſame thing may profite v wee may thereby receyue leſſon wee may apply owne behoofe let v vnderſtande oft whenſoeuer happeneth greate inconuenience vnto v wee muſte make ſuch excuſes theſe yea cannot abyde preſent miſaduenture god woulde handle mee ſome maner ſhall well come let v ſet oure truſt ſo let v conſider howe nothing ought put v pacience turne v aſide god make v vtter rebelles agaynſt let v condemne ſelues owne vice whole part let v acknowledge ala god ſhould exerciſe mee ſorte woulde thing ſhew ſelfe whiche nowe hidden number diſeaſes hidde within mee know ſelfe god knoweth therefore ſtandes hand know ſelfe pray hee ſuffer greate number vice mee burſt libertie make battell againſt rather purge correct lo howe wee ought doo cace ſo let v take concluſion aduenture iob ſetteth downe whē ſayth grudge though god ſpare mee wyll denie wordes holy one vvhat ment ſuppreſsing concealing wordes holy one ment giuing glorie vnto god poynts reſpects iobs meening effect god ſhall haue ſcourged mee vttermoſt yet wyll denie bee woorthie prayſe acknowledge lorde good ryght thou ſhouldeſt ſcourge thy creature foraſmuche thy hande diſpoſe thou mee thy good pleaſure iob proteſteth aſſuredly ſo proteſteth knowing himſelfe haue ſayde lette v learne enter ſelues tie ſelues vnto men aſſoone wee ſhall haue made ſuche proteſtation god wyll laugh v ſcorne nothing elſe follie fondeneſſe man ſay ſuche thing happen wyll therefore man come poynte needes muſte god laugh pride ſcorne good ſooth oure ſtrength whereof wee boaſt lette v knowe maner ſo euer god handle intreate v wee muſte alwayes haue diſcretion glorifie beſeeching ſo guyde v holy ſpirite hee giue v vertue pacience thereafter ſhall pleaſe afflict v thus yee ſee haue marke ſtreyne heerewithall hee addeth vvhat ſtrength ſhoulde bee able indure ſtrength ſtrength ſtones fleſhe ſteele heere iob entreth intoo complayntes ſhewe hee hath iuſte cauſe cha • e maner althoughe hee paſſe meaſure ſo god ſayeth hee ſyde exceſsiue chaſtyzing yee ſee effect hee purpoſeth ſaye wee ſee whiche haue touched heeretofore witte iob ſo ouerpreſſed preſent payne hee hath regarde reſte vtterly blinde poynte wee muſte marke well yee ſee cace wee bee experience ſheweth ſame vvhenſoeuer wee haue anye trouble ſtrayghtwayes withoute regarding eye dazeled ſo wee diſcerne betweene redde greene wee babble purpoſe muche muſte wee marke conteyned heere iob ſayeth heere ſtrength true ſtrength nothing hee knoweth ſtayeth vpon nexte way make impacient hee afore iob thinkes ſtrength fayleth ſaue preſent miſerie hee indureth contrarywiſe lette men try themſelues throughly ſearche well ſhall finde leaſte inconuenience troubleth pricketh without greate greefe meane touching bodie nothing reſpect iob indureth ſpirituall temptation whereof haue ſpoken deſyreth bee eaſed miſerie hee myghte knowe infirmitie humble himſelfe god ſo myght confeſſe good reaſon ſhoulde handled maner vvhat hee intendeth ſhewe howe god handleth extraordinary faſhion men woont bee ſo ouerpreſſed meening enter field battell god god ſhoulde likewiſe take ſwoorde wote lo howe iob runnes heade muſt demaund ſeeke ſtrēgth ſelues ſtrēgtheneth v wee ſhall neuer finde thing vanitie ſelues thinke ſelues haue ſtrength carie one fardel ſhal find ſelues ouerwhelmed vnder wee faynte ſelues needeth aduerſitie come otherwhere beare v downe ſtrength none godwarde true outwarde ſhewe maye well ſeeme bee ſome ſtrength v ſame deede verie ſhadow foraſmuch wee know ſtrength nothing let v conclude generall ala ſhall become god lay hande vpon mee ought indure farre greeuouſer torment yet notwithſtā ding lift vp ſelfe agaynſt thē although god afflict v well body mind yet muſt wee grudge agaynſte condemne hee v wrong foraſmuche wee knowe oure ſtrength care reſpects nothing ye ſee howe wee muſte learne humble ſelues god beſeech ſtrength v aſſuring oure ſelues hee whiche hath ſpirite ſtrength howe belongeth onely gyue v elſe wee ſuſtayned yet neuertheleſſe behoueth v indure long tyme thing let v aſſure ſelues wee ſhould bee vtterly beaten downe firſte blow god ſhould neede make miſerie indure long deſtroy v could warrant himſelfe cōtinue pacient one day one houre onely needeth god prolong miſeries ſhew feebleneſſe make v conuicted let v aſſure ſelues cannot ſo much begin good thing muche leſſe performe therefore ſo muche muſt prouoked pray god mainteyne v lift v vp euen ouerthrowne lo maner wee muſte conſider owne weakeneſſe wee muſte conſider iob ſay god keepeth meaſure towardes v rather let v marke wee haue diſpleaſed god chaſtizeth v ſteed amending vnder rod become worſe worſe vvhy ſo bycauſe god toucheth v fall blaſpheming name beholde vttermoſt full heyght euill let v learne god remedie vice hee muſte abate deuiliſhe pride make v knowe otherwiſe ſhall neuer profite chaſtizementes hee ſende v wee knowe euill v muſt miſlyke ſeeke remedie ſay ala god true ſo feeble weake nothing vanitie mee neuertheleſſe pleaſe thee ſtrengthen mee thou onely haſte ſtrength ſtone ſteele alſo thy ſtrength infinite let ſtones rockes come ruſhe agaynſt thee let ſtorms tempeſts ſo may ſeeme whole worlde ſhall ſunken bottomleſſe pitte yet certaine lorde thy ſtrength alwayes inuincible therefore vouchſafe fortifie mee thy holy ſpirite ende although bee frayle mine owne nature yet may ceaſſe fight agaynſte temptation come aſſayle v vvhen wee ſhall haue done thus ſhall haue profited greatly poynt learning herewithal let v vnderſtand ſide alſo god paſſe meaſure ſend v ſuch temptation haue leyſure take breath behoueth v cry ala god ſend v ſuch temptation yea euen hundred become it▪ true nature quaile cace god haue pitie vpon v call vpon helpe v trouble way wherby may bee deliuered yea ouercome pacience behoueth men prepare themſelues meanes afflictions▪ may feele hād god haue ſuccour may outſtand cōbats ſhall put muſte haue recourſe vnto praying ſtrengthē power holy ſpirite may cōſtātly paſſe aduerſities world vntill gathered euerlaſting reſt prepared thē heauen according hath bin purchaſed v lord ieſus chriſt ſo let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledgemēt fault praying make v better perceyue thē haue done ſuch wiſe beeing conuinced want may haue oure whole recourſe mercie beſeeching father lorde ieſus chriſt although wee worthy bee reckened among creature yet accept v child ſo may learne taſte loue goodneſſe therwithall ſtrengthē v ſuch wiſe al affliction ſhall make v feele may able withſtand thē euen till haue drawen v away himſelf make v inioy victory purchaſed lord ieſus chriſt triumph tarieth v heauen may pleaſe graūt grace onely v alſo people nation c xxv sermon thirde vpon ſixt chapter sermon conteyneth rest expoſition xiij xiiij verſes followeth 15 brother haue beguyled mee dryebrooke vvaters paſſe throughe valleyes 26 troubled vvith yce full ſnovve 17 aftervvarde fayle drought taken place heate 18 turne aſide diuerſe vvayes vaniſh periſh 19 haue ſeene vvayting quarter thema come seba 20 beeing vvere confounded hauing hoped vvhen vvere come place vvere aſhamed 21 behold hovv driebrookes ye haue bene amazed ſight mee 22 haue ſaide bring hither giue goodes 23 deliuer enemie reſcue hand tyrans firſt ſentence haue hearde tendeth end mā preſſed ſo cā deſerues well excuſed exceſsiue paſsions iob alleadgeth excuſe although ſpeake meaſure ſayth men muſt think much blame miſery inforceth true colour may admitted among men godward cannot iuſtified wee alledge miſerie ſo exceſsiue wote god able aſſwage wee deſire hand furtheremore cannot excuſe ſelues preſent maner god ſhall bee accuſed regard welfare hādled v without anye aduiſement verely men thinke yet wee ſpeake god ought open oure mouth reuerence ſobreneſſe let v conſider whether god chaſtyze v diſcretion vvhen agreed vpon god knoweth hee afflicteth v hee neuer paſſeth meaſure ſame muſte go payment come excuſe ſelues rather muſt yeeld ſelues giltie ſeeing iob hath fayled behalfe lette v go rather remedie whiche wee bee combered greate aduerſities wee ſhoulde haue oure recourſe vntoo god praying voutſafe ſuccoure v ſo dooing wee ſhall finde hee eaſe v ſo muche ſhall bee needefull alſo hee ſuffer v quayle althoughe ſhall ſeeme oure calamity gulfes ſwallowe v vp yet god vpholde v hande preſerue v ſuche wyſe wee ſhall come poynte bee vtterlie ouerthrowen true reſpect oure ſelues god intent oure weakeneſſe ſhoulde bee knowne ſhoulde ſhewe ſelfe intent wee myght haue whereof boaſte oure ſelues rather fooliſhe haultineſſe v myghte bee beaten downe yet wee ſhall bee ſuccoured due tyme yee ſee bee ſayde concerning ſentence ſayde freende ought doo good whiche afflicted iob complayneth men haue feare god ſentence oughte bee common among v wee muſte go ſchoole ſay let v haue compaſsion vpon ſuch diſtreſſe ingrauen men man hee skill ſay ſpecially wee bee aduerſitie euery v deſyre men haue pitie thinke vpon releefe yee ſee heere leſſon ought bee knowen v yet meane whyle man practyzeth therefore ſo muche leſſe wee bee excuſed oure common prouerbes ſerue v condemnation veryeſt idiot ignoranteſt perſones worlde cannot ſay haue hearde whiche common ordinarie among men man conſyder prouerbes runne abrode hee ſhall finde record ynough reproue ſuch woulde take couert god ſay knewe learned warned wee haue skill ynough ſay man ought greeue afflicted hee ought pitie yet wee conſider whit ye ſee latter day god ſhall haue nothing put long inditements againſt v crueltie whiche wee vſe towards neyghbours euery man bee owne iudge cace let v marke mention made compaſsion gentleneſſe ſame extendeth farre cace ſtandeth onely vpon geuing meate drink man hee hungred thirſt vpon giuing ſome bodily releefe alſo vpon comforting man hee troubled ſorowe anguiſh mind man hemmed aduerſitie comming vex put harte altogither rather meanes muſte bee ſought comfort ſo curteſye wherevnto wee bee bounde nature lyeth onely dooing ſome pleaſure alſo beeing hardharted ſhake aduerſitie without regarde cōdemne double end miſerie ſhoulde greater rather bee meeke gentle ſo find hart mourne mourne scripture exhorteth v bee glad neyghboures proſperitie yee ſee wee haue marke ſayde man ſaketh feare god hee hath compaſsion afflicted trulye man remember well rule whiche giuen lorde ieſus chriſt hee ſhall well ſee howe feare god v wee bee ſo ſhrunke away ſo yee ſee howe lorde ieſus chriſt telleth v wee ought followe oure heauenly father wee bee taken child heathen themſelues coulde well skill ſay nothing wherein man dooth reſemble god faſhion himſelfe like vntoo good inaſmuche kindely thing man ſuccour thoſe neceſsitie yee ſee howe god cauſeth dayſunne ſhyne vpon good bad ſee brother ſee mirrour myne owne fleſh myne nature pinched aduerſitie haue care token proofe thinke god ouerbeaſtly ſo without cauſe ſayd ſtreyne ſuche haue pitie vppon poore wretched creature aduerſity haue giuen ouer feare god yee ſee alſo lorde ieſus chriſt ſayeth cheefe poyntes lawe iudgement rightuouſneſſe mercie truthe vvhen wee ſhewe wee feare god deſyre ſerue wee muſte come preſent poynt wee walke ſoundneſſe among men ſo wee bee gyuen guy lefulneſſe malice furthermore wee render euerye man ryght wee maynteyne good ryghtfull caces neere wee wee pitie ſuche haue neede helpe ſuccoring vttermoſt power yee ſee ſay wherein wee ſhall fulfill god lawe wee bee full crueltie ſo euery v thinke onely vpon himſelfe make account howe men fare herein wee ſhewe ſelues haue regarde god wee god eye would conſider hee hath ſet v liue togither communicate one another wee would conſider hee father v wee woulde conſider howe hee hath made v one kinde ende wee ſhoulde one v haue care another none v drawe awaye himſelfe alone conſidering wee haue neede one another therefore bee ſayde ſuche turned away kindhartedneſſe haue alſo turned backe vpon god yea knowe thing manhood let v beare well minde ſentence proue ſelues haue feare god behoueth v labour good afflicted true obſeruing general rule wee bee bounde good men howbeit foraſmuchas wee haue greate hardneſſe hart wee muſt bee ſoftened ſyght euerye one diſtreſſe ſame good meane breake abate enmity euill haue bene afore man bee proſperitie aflote bee hated afterwarde fall haue ſome greate ſtorme lyght vpon head ſayd hatred bene afore ceaſſeth inſomuche whiche borne rancour agaynſte woulde fayne haue eaten hart guttes ſay ſomewhat appeaſed ſee chaunge happened vnto ſeeing affliction ynough kill hatred make enmitie ceaſſe pray ſhall wee ſee neighboures aduerſitie ought double moued ſuccoure thoſe torment ſting poore folke miſerie heauineſſe onely vnkind bicauſe haue compaſsion alſo exceede forſomuch come increaſe miſcheefe ſee man mourneth deſireth ſuccour turne backe vpon cruell ſhewe ſelfe knowe nother god nature another come laugh mock deſyreth bee ſomewhat releeued ſo comming doubleth greef ſuche one alſo double cruell true haue dealte churliſhly behalfe commeth ſet foote vpon poore man throte dooth hee ſhew himſelfe bee wild beaſte yea beaſtly ſuch iobs freendes whome complaineth therefore proue oure ſelues god child let v learne ſhake miſerie aſſuring ourſelues thing whervnto god calleth v whereby haue record whither wee take father ſay vſe brotherlineſſe towards men wiſe let v beware wee lift vp ſelues againſt ſuch indure aduerſitie wee oppreſſe moreouer wee ſee greater deſpiſing god wee made reckening thus yee ſee haue marke herevpon iob vſeth ſimilitude comparing freendes dry brooke looke vpon brooke ſayeth runneth time ſometimes dry come great ſhot water freze man ſhall ſee greate houge heape froſt laſteth afterward fall ſnow behold water come guſhing downe brooke ſo ſwolne hee ſcarce keepe himſelfe within bank ouerfloweth mā would thinke ſhould continue ſo alwayes brooke paſſeth hee goeth ſayth end dryeth vp ſo man go way thema way seba hope find water ſhall deceyued theſe country wilde reſpect lande iewrye deſertes betwixt dry waye maner vntrauellable therefore place neede water refreſh men behold trauellers ſayeth ſhall haue ſeene ſuch brooke bee glad ſurmiſe themſelues wee haue riuer giue v ſome refreſhing wee bee athirſt wee may drinke water wee ſhall haue continuallye hande come drye place think refreſh themſelues haue water heate greate ſee themſelues deceyued therefore abaſhed greeued angrie matter lo ſayeth hee euen ſuch without cauſe iob alledgeth ſimilitude haue ſeene heretofore freends whiche come comfort men greate countenaunce doubte honoured renoumed wiſe men euen oure ſelues maye perceyue common perſons▪ excellent giftes grace touching matter iob ſayeth wiſedome blaſte winde ſo cheefe poynte man haue egall ſtedineſſe bee full vaunt fling feeldand make great floriſhes ſheeld afterwarde meene nothing deede onely brauerie according wee ſhall ſee ſome make fayre face turning hand become men ſomuche ſometimes man would ſay behold yonder angel anone mā ſhall ſee waſh away like water ſo holde iob applying cōpariſon freends ſheweth haue ſayd egall ſtedineſſe ſayd holde themſelues requiſite aboue thing men therfore haue profitable leſſon gather vpon ſentence muche better v bee ſome little ſpring whiche ſhall ſeeme haue greate ſtore water bee greate brooke bee dryed vp tymes maye bee ſome little ſpring perchaunce well ſeene hath one little hole ſo man ſhall haue muche draw vp one pot water yet notwithſtanding ſpring continueth alwayes ſtill ſerueth one turne keepeth courſe dryeth vp true ſuch one beareth greate ſhewe much made among men ſpring ſelfe ſhall lye hid ſo man may paſſe ouer perceyue head innermore yet muche better haue little trickling grope v holdeth continueth ſtill tyme tyme haue houge guſhing ſtreames make greate ſhewe length dry vp howe yee ſhall ſee ſome man ſtill man maketh great talk laboring mā ſhall ſome handycraftes man greate reputation ſoeuer hee hee lead blameleſſe life hee laboreth faythfully referring himſelfe god contenteth himſelfe little hath god giue child hee bringeth vp hee good example hee gyueth occaſion ſtumbling moreouer hee ſure hee make greate trouble royots hand ſo long hee ſtretch hither thither haue ſayde hee ſheweth littleneſſe hee able help neyghbour beſides cōfirming good example god dooth alſo gyue grace imploy himſelfe ſmall matter truely hee hath greate ſhewe worldward yet cace ſo ſtandeth hee may ſerue mannes turne euen littleneſſe yee ſee howe ſuche man holding himſelfe ſorte lowlineſſe continuing race may cōpared pretie ſpring neuer dryeth though bee little ſhall bee ſome woorke wonder woulde ſeeme mo men firſte bluſhe yee woulde ſay beholde wee ſee wonder lette man looke throughly vpon hee ſhall finde ſame lacke ſpoken bee practized learned ſcripture yea talk countenance themſelues peraduenture alſo bee ſome gay ſhewe theyr lyfe see heere likeneſſe drybrooke make greate noyſe water come downe togither▪ ſnowes melted ſhould ſeeme whole doozen greate ſprings fell intoo guſhed greate violence yee ſhall ſee man beareth greate countenance let bee throughly vewed ſay let marked hee dooth length hee ſhall bee founde fayle hold hee haue ſhewe vertue hee ſhall haue ſo greate vice matched pity ſee ſomuch mā ſhall ſee ſeeketh nothing make himſelfe well eſteemed whereas hee hath ſo vnreaſonable faultes backebyting one man beguyling another world ſhall bee aſhamed rather laugh skome yee ſee dry brooke well ſwolne whyle ende dryed vp cauſe haue ſayd ought well aduiſed take good heede euery man himſelfe pray god make v perceyue owne infirmity end wee caſt ſelues ſort boūds purchace great reputation amōg men cheef ſtudy bee haue liuing water ſpoken ſeuenth iohn true water ought flow foorth ought make one another parttakers giftes god hath gyuen v yet meane ſeaſon headſpring muſt lye couered within wee muſt bee ſatisfied god hath giuen v afterward deale therof among oure neyghboures euery man according abilitie behold effect wherevnto muſte apply compariſon ſet downe heere extendeth farre wee ſee howe iob ſpeaketh hys freends made pretence bee redye ſuccoure neede yet fayled ſuch wiſe deceyued hope hee according dauid ſayeth tablefreendes ſhewe head tyme neede vve ſee dayly experience ſayde greate ſorte dry brooke worlde ſay greate ſorte howge water rore make mightie noyze certeintie neyther haue euenflowing courſe holde ende intent wee bee ſhamed foraſmuche god warneth v aforehande lette v conſider men drybrookes although ſeeme bee maruelouſe ſtreames tyme yetnotwithſtanding vaniſhe ſlippe awaye ſuche wyſe man cannot tell water become truſted vpon seing god ſheweth v ſhall bee ſo yea beſides woord wee haue experience alſo ſhall wee maruell matter come paſſe lette v beare well minde muſt gaze men ſo dooing wee ſhall bee diſappoynted expectation let v rather learne hold v fountayne liuing water ſhewed vnto v prophete ieremie god blameth vnthankefulneſſe men whiche dig themſelues pittes cranyed ceſternes holde water meane tyme forſake welſpring lyuing water wherwith ought bee filled continually one ſhoulde make man greate promiſes woulde greate fault founde ſhould fayle neede howe ſo would ſayd hath promiſed mee mountaynes mynes haue wayted vpon good fayth haue indeuered ſelfe ſeruice giueth mee ſlip make none acconnt mee behold ſay complaint made ordinary marke god chaſtizeth v hauenot leaned vnto became v doo long ſuccoured hath promiſed bicauſe wee haue ſhrunke away creature put oure truſte creator therefore good reaſon ſhould bee diſappoynted hope put ſhame brought vnder foote thoſe whome wee haue truſted vnto ſo fooliſhlye thus yee ſee wee haue beare minde yet way wee muſt abhorre ſuch like drybrookes god hath ioyned v one another intent oure continuing heere ſhoulde bee comfort one another euerye one v ſhoulde take peece hys neyghboures burthen bee nothing gay countenance meane wee haue care one another ſee yee thing tendeth peruert order nature wee muſte miſlyke make fayre proteſtations ende doe ſhrinke wetting ſuche wiſe water whiche made ſhewe nothing elſe bleare folk eye mennes wayting vpon vaine nowe ſuche maner men deſerue bee condemned bee ſayde brooke defyle thing minde carye afore much better brooke ſhould dry vp ſtill haue ſuche ſwellings marre feeldes medowes turning vp afore according wee ſee brooke ouerflowe bankes leaue nother lande houſe tree ſweepe awaye afore domage thereof ſhall bee one yeere alone ſometymes groundes feele good whyle yea euen ſuch maner men ſhall bee able ſowe anyething vpon ſhall bee turned ſande grauell wee ſee manie theſe dryebrookes yea wee muſte bee fayne bee accuſtomed authoritie beare mace iuſtice ought bee ryuer refreſhe ſuche readie faynte ſuccour ſuche diſtreſſed trample folke vnder theyr feete oppreſſe ryght equitie maynteyne naughty packes would put hauocke lift vp themſelues openly againſt god needes long examination theſe thing apparant eye riche good world haue landes poſſeſsions liue rente marchauntes haue good trade traficke theſe ought bee riuers water place paſſe aboundance god hath gyuen ouerflowe bankes nothing elſe ouerthrowing one turning vp another thereafter god hath giuen euery ability ſo thinketh himſelf haue power anoy greeue neighbour ye ſee ſorte men doo defaulte beguyle thoſe haue wayted vpon haue ſtreame water floude yea deſtroy turne vp thing vvhen ſee geere let v aſſure ſelues ſuch men enemyes nature woorke ſpyte vnto god herewithall let v alſo marke meanes god wakeneth v draweth v intent wee ſhoulde learne put truſt furthermore haue touched alredie euery v put minde dutie whē haue ſayd waterſpring v thereafter haue drawne ſaid fountain liuing water ſay god muſt keepe ſaid grace incloſed v muſt ſpring neuer drieth vp therwithall water muſt flow neighbor alſo according meaſure euery mā ſhall haue receyued ſo let ſtudie may cōmon profite furtherance others according god wil thing haue receiued ſhould ſerue ſelfe alone ſhould ſuppreſſe wil▪ ſhould deale forth ſuch haue want euery man ſhoulde indeuer like thus yee ſee wee haue remember effect vpon ſtreyne furthermore wee muſte alſo wey ſayd man commeth way thema greate beate water summerbrookes fayle notwithſtanding wintertyme moiſter ground bene greate quantity water ſeemed maruelous commonly bee ſeene theſe iolly fellowes ſtande ſo much vpon reputation make ſo great noyſe vvhy ſo hold themſelues modeſty ouerflow bankes ſwell ſuche ſorte ſhould ſeeme totoo inuincible ſtrength ſpred wing whē eaſe promis cōmeth puſh nothing ſo ſo riuer requiſite greate heate sommer dry coaſt ſhal winter moyſt ground ſo alſo muſt vertuouſneſſe ſhew ſelf whē cōmes true tryall god afflict man thing wherein ought ſhew himſelfe pacient afterward hehoue imploy himſelfe vpon neighbour ye ſee wherein ought ſhew charitie let v beare mind ſuch indeuer make thēſelues renoumed farre ſhew themſelues drybrookes end wheras walke meaſure compaſſe keeping thē ſelues modeſtie making greate ſhewe greate noyſe raunging farre inlarge theyr border ſhall bee welſpring couered hidden haue touched heeretofore ceaſſe doo well yet howſoeuer bee wee ſee hath greate abundance man myght ſaye likely ſhoulde neuer fayle howbeeit ſame commodious bryngeth profite theſe greate brooke make ſo great noyze ouerflowing bankes ſo make greate ſhewes muſters hande nothing elſe litle ape toyes parte let v take bee ſo wee may ſhunne god ſuffereth fooliſhe vayngloriouſneſſe men ſo gyuen vanitie • u • ne mockerie themſeluesto bee put ſhame certaine ſuche ſet ſuche ſtore themſelues woulde make themſelues renowmed led vayngloriouſneſſe ſuche wyndineſſe ſwelling would ſtill quyet would hunt ſo great reputation foraſmuche bee ſo haultye themſelues ſay foraſmuche driuen led vaynegloriouſneſſe good reaſon god ſhoulde make reprochefull among men ende wee ſhoulde knowe howe nothing leaſing theyr cace yee ſee oughte holde v yet ſtill awe wee become drybrookes euery v may reſerue himſelfe till neede requyre although worlde deſpiſe v yet notwithſtanding▪ let v like better walke lowlineſſe thā make ſhewes ſay haue haue nay let v reſerue ſelues good purpoſe releue neceſsitye bothe oure ſelues oure neyghbours let v lauiſhe time laſhe aduenture one puſhe afterwarde drye vp ende wee doe ſo wee ſhall bee lyke drybrookes thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne iob addeth hee deſyred freendes releeue theyr good yet bee borowe reſcowe handes enemyes yet notwithſtanding meane ſeaſon drawne backe vvhen iob ſayth hee requeſted freends giue thing pay ranſome meeneth apply ſimilitude whiche wee haue expounded owne purpoſe hee ſhoulde ſay deſyre giue good haue done ſo might ye well withdrawe ſelues mee muche reaſon water ſhoulde bee dryed vp you▪ yee myght cut way fountayne ſhoulde ſue helpe mee craue nothing yet neuertheleſſe man may ſee yee dazeled onely ſight miſeries therefore ſo dooyng yee ſhewe ſelues well bee drybrookes lette v remember well accuſation heere wee maye profit oure ſelues althoughe wee haue ſome ſhewe ſeeme wee readie forewarde myghte bee yet wee ſuccoure oure neighbour haue lacke v therein ſhew ſelues drybrookes matter ſtandeth vpon ſuccouring thoſe good ſtand neede alſo vpon hauing compaſsion without anie abatement oure ſubſtance ſith coſteth v nothing ſo muche ſhall wee bee vnexcuſable wee bee nigardlie haue pitie vppon ſuche diſtreſſe thus yee ſee wherein iob ment ſhewe ouergreate hypocriſie thoſe haue ſo fayre gloſſe little whyle yet ſtedineſſe firmeneſſe therefore ſerueth condemne ſuche ſame ſute theſe dayes according wee ſee ſome ſo farre taking anie good ſuccoure haue neede although nothing bee deſyred yet greefe peine vnderſtand want neyghboures ſay greefe ſygh ſorineſſe man cannot wreſt ſygh rather could finde harte poore neyghboures rooted oute woulde wiſhe deade pity ſake ſorowe ſee diſtreſſe rather skornfulneſſe whiche maketh ſhunne ſuche ſee neceſsitie ſo greate vnkindeneſſe yee ſhall ſee ſome man wyll bee frende vttermoſt yea ſo long hee proſperitie god lay hande vpon wee voutſafe regarde creature made image god wee woulde bee newe worlde wee myght haue ſuche thing meete inſomuche wee aſhamed onely ſay ſuche man ſpake mee euen nowe ſpake seeing holie ghoſte dooth mouth iob condemne ſuche extreme hypocriſie lette v looke ſelues wee ſee affliction eyther greate ſmall let v aſſure ſelues god ſummoneth v make v vnderſtande louing kindneſſe wee ought put vre towards thoſe ſo ioyned vnto v god ſhould prouide well mākind good pleaſure man payne euery man contented well eaſe ſende ſuche neceſsities ende whiche ſuche want needineſſe ſhoulde haue pitie euery man owne behalfe according abilitie god hath giuen ſhoulde ſtreyne himſelfe helpe thoſe haue neede example mā perchaunce well eaſe aſſoone hee ſeeth poore bodye hee ſhall bee touched carefulneſſe greeueth ſee neceſsitie although diſtribute good yet ſuccour man twayne ceaſſe haue pitie vpon thoſe ſuccoured could finde hart man ſhall bee much ſet another ſhall much richer bycauſe hath longing gyue meate drink ſuche lacke god alſo wyll cauſe men haue pitye tyme neede according hee promiſeth ſuch haue bene mercifull pitifull ſhall finde lyke happen bee pinched aduerſitie others ſhall pay ſuche meaſure haue meaſured vnto others yee ſee wee haue beare minde namely ſee neighbour aduerſitie muſt frame ſelues moued affectioned releeue well yet notwithſtanding wee performe dutie diſcharge ſelues gyuing good releefe others leaſtwiſe lette v ſhewe howe wee haue ſayde pride would cut thoſe v whiche ſuch neceſsitie god afflicteth rather let v know meane whereby god try haue kindly affection v deede muſt alwaies warer diſdeyning thoſe pouerty trouble louing thoſe proſperitie eaſe ſoothing vp reſpects bicauſe beare goodly port worldeward ſo charitie well grounded loue neighbour reſpect helped ſerue owne turnes credit good fauour nay rather let v haue regard follow god cōmaundeth v wit ſhewe charitie vpon thoſe whome knowe haue neede furthermore let v extend doctrine ourſelues ſay let v thinke ynough bliſſe god wee bee proſperitie god ſende v affliction yet lette v ceaſe glorifie reſpects put truſte although wee bee toſſed poſte piller miſeries greeuances world yet neuertheleſſe lette v aſſure ſelues god ſtrong ynough deliuer v alſo ſo referre ſelues wholly prouidence glorifie holie name ſhall pleaſe ſende v well proſperity aduerſity ye ſee effect haue mark cōcerning text touching iob addeth teache mee haue doone amiſſe cānot bee declared therefore reſerue till morow lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceyue better ende beaten downe oure ſelues wee maye haue oure recourſe ſouerayne goodneſſe reſte oure ſelues vpon vayne truſtes falſe imagination wherewith worlde beguyleth ſelfe wilfully whenſoeuer hee ſhall ſuffer v bee afflicted worlde euen meane men creature yet notwithſtanding wee maye acknowledge bee hande beateth v ende wee maye indeuer returne vntoo ſeeke remedye cure oure malady onely mercy therefore giue v grace may neuer bee withdrawne conſideration namely may v one labour brought thervnto ende one cōmon accord may yeeld ſelues wholly ſeruice walke feare obedience vntill hee haue taken v mortall body make v parttakers endleſſe glorie maye pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c xxvj sermon fourth vpon ſixt chapter 24 teache ye mee vvill holde peace ſhewe ye vvherein haue doone amiſſe 25 hovv ſtedfaſt rightuouſe vvoordes vvhat fault finder among finde faulte vvithall 26 frame reaſons ouerthrovve matter let vvoordes afflicted go vvinde 27 vvinde fatherleſſe ye dig pit freende 28 turne ye againe conſider marke reaſons lye 29 turne ye againe ſhall none iniquitie turne ye yet againe ryghtuſneſſe ſhall appeare behalfe 30 vvickedneſſe toung dooth mouth feele bitterneſſe greate vertue man yeelde hymſelfe teachable ſay ſubmit himſelfe reaſon withoute men muſt needes ouerſhoote thē ſelues deſpite god proofe heereof cheefe honoure god requyſeth hand whatſoeuer know proceede bee receyued without gaynſaying hild good rightfull men frame themſelues therevnto certeinly truthe reaſon proceede god therefore let v conclude god hath ſoueraintie authoritie ouer v except men yeeld themſelues fully whiche knowe true reaſonable ſhall haue profited greatly lyfe wee ſhall haue learned humble ourſelues ſo farfoorth aſſoone reaſon thing knowne vnto v wee make gayneſaying ſhewe ſelues ſtubborne hard agree vnto rather doo ſuch honoure god ſay lord wee ſee make warre agaynſt thee ſhould ſtand caſe thy truth true marke thy diuine glory therefore whoſoeuer woorſhip thee muſte obey thy truthe otherwyſe muſt needes troden vnder foote thys matter iob treateth thys ſtreyne proteſteth hee bee taught holde tung deſyre haue ſhewed hym wherein hee hath doone amiſſe doubt iob dooth heere hys owne perſone giue common rule child god vvhich rule god ſhall haue ſhewed v wherein wee haue doone amiſſe wee muſt open mouthes alledge tryfling excuſes enter intoo defence dooings wee muſt gyue eare ſhall told v without incountering generally wee muſt receyue good doctrine ſoone ſpoken without asking whither ſo wee know bee ſo muſt go without kicking againſt pricke haue ſayd great vertue bee ſo teachable ſo alſo let v vnderſtande rare vertue lyghtly bee found among men nay rather wee ſee fooliſh preſumptuouſneſſe ſo euery man weeneth wyſe hys owne conceyt heerevppon groweth ſuch deueliſh wilfulneſſe although wee ſhewe ſelues bee conuicted yet many v wyll neuer yeelde rather ſo ſhameleſſe brazenfaſte maynteyne whiche againſt reaſon wellynough ſo bee foyled muche ought wee marke well ſayde heere although iob treate heere owne vertuouſneſſe yet notwithſtanding goddes holy ſpirite ſetteth heere eye lookingglaſſe example v followe let v wedded owne fancy ſhould quietly herken whiche tolde v yea euen commeth poynt wee muſt bee rebuked oure faulte iob treateth thereof eſpeciall againſt fooliſh ouerweening men bee conuicted haue done amiſſe haue ouerſeene themſelues bee aſhamed caſt themſelues intoo thouſand abſurdities bee caried away ſo become lyke brute beaſts facing matter deſpite god glory opinionholders bee men neuer ouercome firſt therefore let v marke thing ſhall propounded vnto v wee muſte ſo wilfulminded ſay looke haue conceyued wil ſtand vnto let v beware ſuch wilfulneſſe deadly plague wee ſhall bee ſo headſtrong wilfull matter wee take hande one wee ſhould ſhet gate againſt god ſay hee ſhall come although hee viſite v although bee deſyrous ſhewe v greatly welfare yet notwithſtanding repulſe grace haue ſayd already namely god child muſt haue ſpirit meekeneſſe ſay muſt haue peaſable quyet mynd wee muſt ſuffer ſelues handled behold alſo wherfore lord ieſus chriſt likeneth child lamb ſheepe follow voyce ſhepeherd herken vnto ſoone calleth therefore let v learne reproued receyue correction whenſoeuer brought v generally lette v learne yeeld ſelues thing knowe good god taught muſt wee follow haue touched already thoſe ſo wedded owne opinion certayne god ſetteth foorth bee mockerie reproch ſo ſuffereth haue ſhamefaſtneſſe modeſtic letteth bee wylde beaſtes ſo reuengeth hymſelfe ſuche ſtiffeneckedneſſe men cannot find hart yeelde bowe neck agreeing iob meeneth holding peace holding tong man may teache v wee perchaunce ſhall ſay true yea wee may perchaunce alwayes ſay amen sobeeit yet peraduenture may bee ſome wil hold tong yet notwithſtanding cōtinue ſtill ſtubborne fancy whatſoeuer befall yee ſpeake man fully determined yeeld mum vtter woord ye ſhall get open lippes yet notwithſtanding holding peace without ſtubborneſſe iob ſpeaketh holding peace meeneth man warned hee ſhould incounter ſo man gyue one woord hee ſhoulde gyue three contrarye wee ſhould ſimply gyue eare ſayde thus yee ſee holy
