ſcripture meeneth holding one pe • ce holding one tong commaunded hold peace vnto god intent wee ſhoulde make adoo bycauſe paſsions roaring make ſuch noyſe god haue audience heard v ſo let v lerne ſpeake hold peace taught firſt lette v learne hold tongs witte hinder grace god offered v wee giue eare keepe mouth ſhet ſo wee reply furthermore let v alſo learne ſpeake ſay confeſſe god truthe good fault bee found according ſayde haue beleeued therefore ſpeake let v yeeld ſuch record vnto god goodneſſe alſo indeuer drawe others lo wherevntoo ſpeaking muſt ſerue namely end ignorant may bee defyed wee may one common accord bee god true ſcholers ſo doctrine may receyued whenſoeuer liſteth play ſchoolemayſter among v thus ye ſee wee haue marke vpon thys ſtreyne euer doctrine needefull bee practized nowadayes time ſee ignorance world pray darkneſſe haue bin needes hold v haue cō ceyued ſhall become v vve haue bin ſo lewdly taught hath bene nothing confuſion whole lyfe god graunted v grace gyue hearing mencioned thys place thing bene day wee ſee manye continue ignoraunce bycauſe cannot abyde heare paciently tolde god dooth iuſtly puniſhe haſtineſſe lifting vp themſelues agaynſt hym furthermore wee ſee thing ſo confuzed throughout wee bee weldiſpozed ſettled herken ſhewed v goddes name apply ſame behoofe certayne wee ſhall bee lyke ſtraying beaſtes euery man ſhall wander heere none v ſhall keepe right way ſeeyng wee haue ſuche neede bee teachable haue meeke mynde receyue ſayde vnto v let v learne repreſſe theſe fond affection auaunce themſelues wee ſee vayngloriouſneſſe ſelues according ſome deſyrous ſet themſelues ſpeake agaynſte truthe knowe purpoſe purchace themſelues fame otherſome firie wit runne rouers ſuche ſorte man neuer brydle seing wee knowe theſe vice bee v let v learne correct intent may bee thing hinder v holding oure peace keepe ſelues quiet till wee haue lerned good god teacheth v thus much cō cerning firſt verſe touching reſidue ſayeth teache yee mee ſhewe wherein haue doone amiſſe meeneth although god child ought meeke receyue correction good doctrine yet notwithſtanding ment ſhoulde bee without wiſdome diſcretion ſee happened popedome vnder coloure beeing ſimple mē ſay muſt walk ſimplicitie true meening men ſhould ſuffer themſelues bee led like brute beaſtes without diſcerning betweene whyte blacke nought lord promiſeth faythfull one ſpirite diſcretion intent ſhould bee led heere daunce euery mannes pype bee led lyke poareblind men vvhat done vvee muſt taught wee muſt haue knowledge certayntie god truthe followe obey ſame man ſhall haue ſhewed v faultes wee muſt take warning aryght thereby followe good eſchue euill thus ye ſee ment thys woorde teach placed heere profitable warning many folke whiche thynke ynough receyue whatſoeuer ſayde yea euen without warrant ſo without hauing firmeneſſe ſame wee haue true fayth god truthe muſt ſealed hart holie ghoſte ſo wee may fully reſolued according ſainct iohn ſayeth wee knowe ourſelues child god ſayeth wee ſuppoſe weene haue conceyued confuzed intangled opinion hee ſpeaketh knowledge true wiſedome commeth fleſhly reaſon nother oure owne witte vnderſtanding bring v god learning ſurmounteth capacitie man yet neuertheleſſe behoueth v conſider truth bee throughly reſolued receiue whatſoeuer men tell v auenture vnder ſhadowe ſimplicitie without knowing wee muſt diligently inquire thing told v vnderſtande doctrine good muſt determine fully ſelues hold v thencefoorth replying hygh treaſon open mouth agaynſt god thus yee ſee wee haue marke heere ſuch ryghtly taught concerning god may well bee angrie thoſe woulde diſguyze god trueth leaſings lyke theſe dayes requiſite v armed example iob may beate backe wicked ſlaunders wherewith enemy god woorde labour ouerthrowe turne away fayth ye ſee papiſts doo v greate wrong inſomuch ſhoulde ſeeme wee woorthy grounde ſhoulde beare v meane talke ſhewing ynough thē haue filled eares ignorant ſort afore hand bearing hande ſpeake againſte holye churche bycauſe wee ſubiect traditiōs haue made yea ſayd god woorde muſt receyued therefore whoſoeuer ſpeaketh muſt aduaunce himſelfe bring fancy muſt ſpeake ſuch wyſe men may knowe thing whiche hee vttereth godly god muſt god exalted among v alſo papiſtes prye caſt vp skum behoueth v bee alwayes readye bee taught yea howbeit ſo doctrine men liuing god whome hee hath appointed onely mayſter witte oure lord ieſus chriſt nameth himſelfe ſhepherd intent wee ſhould flocke onely voyce ſhould bee herd among v ſhould ſhake voyce ſtraungers moreouer agaynſte papiſts wee muſt bee armed warning day ſo miſerable tyme childrē god haue great neede inuincible conſtancie reſiſt ſo many ſo ſundry aduerſaries theſe dayes booteth find fault euill condēne euery man ſupporteth manifeſtly theſe day become ſuch bottomleſſe gulf happen wickedneſſe euery man couereth yea iuſtifieth good muſt needes condemned ſo men feare horrible curſe god hath vttered prophet curſed call euill good good euill truely ſo little men thinke haue ſayde euill ſhall borne withall yea borne good ſhall borne downe vvhen man ſhall haue doone amiſſe twice alſo proceded ſo farre ſpyte god full one ſo haue ſome ſhewe ceremoniouſneſſe man ſhall come ſay ſee thou haſte doone amiſſe yea done lyke ſome ſeruant houſe haue confederate hymſelfe wyth child guzzle wyne play glutton ſome corner maner naughtiue ••• yet fault eſpyed child ſhould make countenāce ſay thou haſt done amiſſe notwithſtanding haue one accord compacted themſelues togither thē commit ſuche ryots vnthriftineſſe men vſe like ceremony day mocke god withall euill exceſsiue contrarily needes muſt cōdemned haue walked ſimplicitie vpryghtneſſe whiche haue maynteyned god quarel theſe muſt paſſe pike cōdemned whyle wicked bolſtred fauoured al mennes hand v may hardily deſpiſe thoſe mocke god ſuch ſort take v cudgell ſerue beate put confuziō heauenly iudge ſay whenſoeuer man ſhall teache v aright let v tractable quiet perceyue hym indeuer confound god truthe turne lye let v abhorre ſuch maner dealing let v always hold owne race ſayd conſequently wordes rightneſſe ſtrong fault finder finde fault heereby iob meeneth ſhew man hath good conſcience ſhall continue ſtedfaſt neuer bee ſhaken thing ſayd true wicked wil labour throughly ouerwhelme yet ſhall continue alwayes ſtedfaſtneſſe hereby warned walke rightly god haue good inward witneſſe hath bin hypocriſie v haue done ſo let men aſſayle v al ſides ſhall haue wherewith hold tacke true ſhall ceaſſe greeued yet ſhall wicked neuer haue vpper hand againſt v haue rightneſſe wherof iob ſpeaketh heere ineſtimable priuiledge ſuch haue kept way rightneſſe ſoundneſſe neuer cōfounded true worldward men may oppreſſe falſe ſlaunders men may diffame ſuche wiſe ſhall ſeeme worſt folke whole world according ſee frowardneſſe reigneth nowadayes ſo nother right indifferencie remayning vve come time wherof prophet eſay cōplayneth namely right openly oppreſſed vprightneſſe truth chaced world beſides ſayeth although miſcheef increaſed ouerfloweth bound yet hath bene man hath vttered one word cleere theſe thing ſo confuzed rather hath ſeemed euery man hath deſyre augment miſcheef behold poynt haue ſayd heeretofore yee ſee ineſtimable priuiledge wee hold thing good whyche world hateth men poynt v wyth finger ſpit face trample reaſon vnder foote although ſee yet notwithſtanding abaſhed ſo wee ſhoulde inclyne wickedneſſe doo alwayes continue faſt rooted grounded ſayde truthe whych myghtie ynough maynteyne v ſo folowing ſhewed heere let v learne hold v always word rightuouſneſſe aſſuring ſelues god euermore bee ſide truth bee ſo myghtie end get vpper true forſomuchas men fugitiue runne ſo headily truth hath alwayes full ſcope ſeeme erewhyles vtterly ouerthrowne let v haue pacience vntill day lord appeare ſayeth paule wherevnto calleth mocking ouerweening ſuche iudge ſo awkly ouerthwartly confuzedly charging thoſe reproches ſayeth wayt day lord til god length diſcouer falſe ſlaunders wherwith haue bin charged whē day ſayeth beginneth appeare thē muſt ryghtfulneſſe come abrode muſt ſlaunderers bee conuicted muſt thing turne confuſion god euen whole lyfe graunt v grace get vpper hand maliciouſe perſones go trample v vnder foote ſhall haue walked vnfeynedly truthe much ſhall wee haue preheminence cace concerneth fayth ſeruice god doctrine ſaluation wit god giue v ſuch ſo ſtedfaſt conſtancie diuell ſhall haue bent force againſt v ſhall gayne nothing hāds according alſo haue promis therof vvherof long bee ſtedfaſter adayes ſeeyng trouble world whereof commeth wee ſee ſo many men giue themſelues naughtineſſe euen bicauſe haue ſaid rightneſſe bycauſe bee fenſed againſt manifold aſſaults whiche satan bendeth agaynſt verely ſome good minde man warne receyue chaſtizement quietly man trouble well hurt man neyther gyue cauſe offence ſee iniquitie hath full ſcope man meene liue ſimplely vprightly hee ſhall bee pricked one ſyde punched ſtarteth aſyde boweth wyth al wyndes whereof commeth ſuch inconſtancie bycauſe haue rightneſſe ſpoken heere well rooted hart behold ſay cauſe wee ſee ſo many wauering men ſure truthe goſpell inſomuch wethercockes turne wyth euery wynd reedes bow euery way euen bycauſe neuer knew power god woord truthe certayne truth ſo ſtrong diuell may well aſſayle v woorke v trouble deuiſe yet howſoeuer world go wee ſhall holde owne wee ſhall abide ſtedfaſt ſtate vvhat bee done let v pray god make v feele power word whereof mention made wit inuincible fortreſſe may knowe ſame experience deede wee blame wee doo let v ſay many ignorant perſons ſaye knowe ſyde turne ſee contrariety mennes opinion one ſayes another ſayes true dyuers opinion ſo muſt fayth tried god ſuffereth according alſo sainct paule ſayeth muſt hereſies intent ſuch god may knowne hauing conſtancie cleauing continually vnto god truth neuer turned ſame alledged many incounters diſputations true muche ſay oure faith muſt therefore bee ſhaken wherein ſhall ſtedfaſtneſſe ryghtneſſe ſhewe ſelfe ſay ſhall man knowe truthe ſo ſtrong ſhall power thereof ſhewe ſelfe v like verye deede ſayde goddes woord indureth euer ment alwayes heauen alſo hart faythfull according ſainct peter ſheweth v although wee bee toſſed many ſtormes tempeſts world yet ſhall fayth neuer ſhaken downe certayne god truthe myghtye ynough withſtand aſſaultes according ſayde victory ouercommeth world namely euen faythe sainct iohn ſayes canonicall epiſtle ſo wee deſyrous profite well goſpell ſchoole god let v learne take followe whiche good alſo anſwer therevnto ſuch wiſe wee maye proteſt doo ſuch thing bycauſe hope bring paſſe alſo bycauſe god wyll gyue mee ſtrength withſtande temptation whych diuell ſhall prepare againſt mee ſo ſhall neuer fayle whatſoeuer betyde ſayd whiche faultfinder among find fault thing ſhewe enemy god may well practyze well vſe craftie conueyances naughtineſſe ſhall neuer obteyne ſuppreſſe truthe ſhall ſtreyne themſelues ſhall deuiſe thing may ſerue ſtrengthen withall yet notwithſtanding thys god maynteyne caſe ſeruantes length ſhewe truthe certayne ſay wicked ſhall indeuer yea ſometimes ſhal ſeeme haue vpper hand meanes god puniſheth vnthankfulneſſe world ſainct paule meeneth ſaying wicked ſuch anoy church ſhal go preuayle increaſe god giueth satan brydle ſuffereth diuels champion aduaunce themſelues ſuch wiſe ſeemeth ought lord god ſuffreth without cauſe ſee vnthankfulneſſe world many would willingly deceyued greued men teache pureneſſe coulde fynde hart god word ſo confuſed yea euen ſuch ſort man myght knowe diſcerne aught twoo face one hoode ſay otherſome although abide heare one ſay truthe yet haue greate care throughly rooted one foraſmuch god ſeeth one ſort ſuche maliciouſneſſe ſort ſuch careleſneſſe turneth euen open rebelliouſneſſe many men quenche lyghte god ſetteth wee maruell ſlacke brydle wicked thoſe turne truthe intoo lying vtterly deface yet meane whyle certayne god ſtrengtheneth mainteyneth thoſe end whome hath taught truth ſo yee ſee wherefore ſaid faultfinder maye well ſtreyne themſelues howbeit ende ſhalbe vanquiſhed god ſhew himſelfe ſide good right ſpoken doctrine goſpel alſo al euer concerneth life faithfull true doctrine ſaluation one preciouſeſt thing god hath therfore ye ſee alſo wil ſhew power thereof ſuch wiſe deſtroy wicked breath mouth ſhall feele ſayd word haue deſpiſed ſworde ſlea driue damnation behoueth god vtter power behalfe aboue al yet doings whenſoeuer wrongfully oppreſſed men whereas ought ſuſteyned ſhal ſeeme goeth cleane backward yet let v ceaſe truſt ſtill god wee may perhaps bee little ſet time may abhorred nothing euill v let v contented haue god angells bee good witneſſes ſoundneſſe let v tary till god chace away droopie darkneſſe make innocencie ſhine may ſeene breake day thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreine iob addeth friend came vnder pretence cōfort haue framed talke confound holy purpoſe ſay confound right ſayings haue let word afflicted paſſe wind heere iob accuſeth thoſe extreme ſpitefulnes proceede ſo egerly againſt behoueth v mark wel point doubt holy ghoſt ſheweth v heere wee haue beware loth diſpleaſe god wold make open war againſt behold ſay vice hateful god whē cūning ouerthrow good matter ſpecially whē happeneth aduaunce ſelues againſt afflicted worldward ſuche preſumptuouſneſſe v prouoke caſt themſelues deſpaire yet vice ſo ouer rife ſo bycauſe man thinketh told heere namely men forge ſuch inuentions ſay deuiſe thing ouerthrow equitie much make ſuch krinks truthe might bee knowne take place one came iuſtle againſt god tooke hym aduerſarie partie men would thynke themſelues ſay thus howe bid battell vnto god certayne wold ſo afraid heare would ſtand vp vpon head ſo would bridle hold ſhould fling themſelues ſo randon ſith thinke ſo little leaſtwiſe let v receiue god ſheweth v ſeeing gyueth v warning ſtreyne ye ſee effect wee haue beare mind wit man ſpeaketh v ſhould delay anſwere vntill wee know matter vve ſee ſome communication miniſtred bee done let v herken marke whither godly true let v pray god giue v ſpirite diſcretion may vnderſtād truth whē haue founde let v replie againſt haue ſayd heretofore moſt men ouerſhoote themſelues vnaduiſedly bycauſe knowe god againſte whome ſet themſelues meanes whereof ceaſe proceede euill conſcience although directly minded ſay wil go iuſtle againſt god yet ſee well ynough god gyueth thē leaue auaunce themſelues ſorte againſt goodneſſe ſuppreſſe good cace ſee well ynough therefore certaine yeeld ſimply good cannot excuſe themſelues haue certaine maliciouſneſſe fought againſt god nowe let triall made bee found mē great ſmall ceaſſe wage deadly warre continually againſt god worke ſpite proofe hereof ſhall euer cace ouerruled iuſtice wherein ſhall bee vſed number ſlights turne good euill yet notwithſtanding looke vpon holieſt beſt priuiledged place ſame ſhamefully defiled none ſuch ſtinking beſtlineſſe euē bawd brothelhouſes wold aſhamed men diſguiſe thing yea corrupt ſuch ſort may ſeeme haue conſpired ſhet equitie vprightneſſe dores yet notwithſtanding mean men make countenance though ſawe ſuch thing would fayne couer leawdneſſe apparant notoriouſe euen like man caſt vp handfull aſhes darken ſunne ſhould ſay day end thing knowne well may yet men ſtil aske worſe ſaid ſame ſeene euen ſeate iuſtice ſide ſeene diuell poſſeſſeth al temple god ought dedicated ſeruing worſhipping god purely commandeth ſtuffed ydolles ſo nothing corruption caneldirt wherwith ſend ſilly ſoules deſtruction effect wee ſee life man nothing diſguiſing thing ſo tidings hearde ſayd ſoundneſſe vprightneſſe whereof wee haue ſpoken heerewithall haue marke thys ſaying word afflicted perſon deſpiſed perſon paſſe away winde ye ſee howe cauſe men auaunce ſelues againſt god ſet much themſelues thinke wiſedome owne brayne truly affaire men haue euery man ſeekes auayles therefore naughtipacke woulde eſchue puniſhment hath deſerued wil haue faire flattery gloſes hand intent ſhuld knowne howe cace ſtandeth whither bee money matter thing behold men corrupt truth turne lie owne aduauntage ſake caſe concerne doctrine faith goſpell elſe cauſe ſo manye counterſayings ſee ſo many sophiſters come adayes mocke god flatly ſophiſticall ſuttleties pride thoſe thinke thē ſelues haue witte ynough winne ſpurres reaſon pro con terme reaſon fro ſides doubt god ſpirite ment taunt pride preſumtuouſneſſe ende purpoſe keepe ſelues enimies god fighting againſt truth ſhoulde ſhake ouerweening deſpiſe oure neighbour tread vnder feete rather contented taught euen little childe god ſhall haue opened vnto vntoo v according sainct paule ſheweth ſuch haue ſpirit prophecie although god haue giuen grace teach others muſt notwithſtanding diſdayne giue place vntoo whome god ſhall haue giuen knowledge yee ſee haue marke ſtreyne finally iob concludeth thoſe pretended friendes nothing elſe dig pit ſuch man ſtumble ought bee hilde vp ſeeke nothing winde fatherleſſe hee vſeth manner ſimilitude bycauſe fatherleſſe childe hath meane defend himſelf left wer ſpoile iob one god ſcourgeth vttermoſt ſheweth v ſhal ſcape god hand vengeance except laboure ſuccoure ſuch miſerable ſay ſuche worthy pitie compaſsion ſayde yeſterday lo haue marke firſt place concluſion hee exhorteth turne againe ſaith hee ſhal none iniquitie turn yee agayne ſaith ageyne righteouſneſſe ſhall appeare behalfe iob exhorting thē ſheweth well mind muſt find fault euill condemne witte bring men backe againe poſsible atteyne therfore let v thinke vpon intent ſuch take warning may periſhe ſinnes rather ſorie thē aſhamed haue offended god maye retourne vnto greater affection true find ſuch haue offended god touched feeling iuſtice vengeance inſomuch man manace ſhall win nothing hand behoueth bee touched quicke make abaſhed hee purpoſe bring thē repentance howſoeuer cace ſtand muſt alwayes ſhoote marke ſhewed v heere witte drawe backe according manner iob vſeth proceeding touching ſayth turne ye againe ſhall none iniquitie true man may expound ſtreyn ſayd ſhall iniquitie reaſon ſaye retourne ye ſhall bee iniquitie turne ye agayne righteouſneſſe ſhall knowen heere iob ſhoulde ſaye hath bin cauſe haue hitherto condemned man whome god caſt away ſo ſeeming ſhuld worſt man worlde cauſe haue cryed ſelfe haue bin herd hand haue turned back al reaſon therefore turne yee agayne righteouſneſſe apparant wil better vnderſtood ſhall haue applied inſtruction firſt formoſt put mind heere whenſoeuer wee condemne good allow euill commeth owne meere default ſo cannot ſay behold haue bin deceyued wiſt matter ment let v alledge certaine ſhall alwayes found blameworthy wee condemne good allowe euill god conuicteth v inaſmuch declareth haue voutſaued open eye ſee hee ſheweth v men followe lie ſted truth ſo blind know good bycauſe haue turned back vpon god ſome maliciouſneſſe ſome hypocriſie ſome careleſneſſe god ſuffer v haue eye ſo ſeeled vp cannot diſcerne betwene good euill bycauſe haue ſo good regard vnto god becommeth v redy teach v familiarly ynough marke ſpeciall poynt whenſoeuer bee ſo caried away wee haue ſpirite wiſe dome euen allow euill yea cheriſh remedy v returne wilfully bent continue falſe opinion wee haue conceyued except wee fall intoo bottomleſſe pit whereoutof eſcaping ſuch ſo bleared cannot abide god ſhould enlighten ſuch manner men muſt needes come top confuſion let v bethinke v turne head aſſoone wee ſhall haue knowen fault god ſheweth v fauoure giue v warning wee giue care heare ſayth ſuffer v bee led aſtray euill continually bring v backe agayne good way herewithall houeth v marke well iob addeth returne ye yet agayne righteouſneſſe appeare betokeneth two thing one inough v come ceremoniouſly ſay true fault▪ according ſee haue fowly offended god haue bin cauſe ſome ſuche vnrecouerable inconuenience ſore whereof required letting bloud inſomuch hath folowed ſome ſtumbling confuſion church▪ euen haue bene giltie ſuch trayterouſneſſe ſhal come ſay true haue done amiſſe nothyng elſe mockerie well ſeene zeale affection proceede behalfe namely minded retourne vnto god verely retourne ſuch ſort may bee knowne repent iob ment ſhewe▪ hee contented hymſelfe haue ſayde turne ye agayne ſayd turne ye agayne ſecond time ſeconde poynte haue marke god ſhall haue diſcouered iniquitie wee haue conceyued ſome wicked imagination hath turned v away good ende behoueth v acknowledge faulte may returne vnto god ſayd applying owne inſtruction wee ſhoulde haue eaſier vnderſtanding men found time ſhall eſtranged god truth right way ſo haue ſome ſcrupulouſneſſe ſome euill opinion according deuill neuer without thys ſlight trump one thing way end god word may haue ſauoure taſt ſpecially may weery verely whē ſuch maner folke retourne ſhall iniquitie ſay god mercifull ſo giueth grace glutted wery word ye ſee ſort iniquitie ceſſeth men returne neuertheleſſe entred good waye behoueth go yet muſt returne yet witte muſt bethinke ala bene poore forelorne creature god pitie hath pleaſed take mee mercy referre ſelfe wholly vnto beſeeching gouerne hencefoorth according good ſuche men retourne double god maketh ſee knew firſt reſpecte heereof lette euery v beethinke himſelfe wee may haue oure recourſe vntoo god praying hee hath inſtructed v hys truth confirme v ſuche ſorte ſame may neuer ſtep right way deuill may neuer thruſt v aſide let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele ſuch wiſe wee may walke according alwayes bee confirmed ſame grace hath gyuen v already called v hys houſhold foraſmuch ſo greatly inclined go aſtray let v pray beare infirmity vntill haue quite cleane rid v ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge ſelues wee bee worthy lift vp oure eye heauen c xxvij sermon first vpon ſeuenth chapter 1 time appoynted man vvhiche vppon earth dayes dayes hireling 2 bondman longeth ſhadovve hireling longeth end hys laboure 3 haue vayne moneths paynefull night appoynted vnto 4 laying dovvne ſay vvhen ſhall riſe bed cloyed vvith bitterneſſe euen vntill euening 5 fleſh clothed vvith vvormes duſt earth skin alto broken corrupted 6 dayes glide avvay like vveauers ſhettle vvaſt avvay vvithout hope know well long liue world wee muſt indure many miſeries yet wee could find hart god ſhould handle v meaſure wee bee ſo tender nice ſo ſoone layeth hand vpon v thinke much yea euen pacienteſt poynt god proceedeth afflicting v ſtill ye ſhall ſee faintneſſe bewray diſcouer ſelfe thing haue handle time iob complayning miſerie indureth ouer long ſayth man ought haue time ſet afore hand ſhoulde ſay god hath ſet v vpon earth ſuch vnquietneſſe ſhould ſome time make ende miſeries ſuch plight haue releaſe reſt night day ſeemeth cace worſe men god minded afflict beyond ſtate man life able beare lo purpoſe wee ſee anſwereth vnto haue touched witte firſt ſight well confeſſe bee good reaſon ſhould troubled ſhould haue hartſores world yet therewithall wee woulde fayne god ſhould ſpare v ſoone hee doth touch v tip finger wee would haue ſtreightwayes withdraw hand affliction ſhould long continuance ſtandes v hand marke well ſtreyne perſon iob holy ghoſte hath ſet frailtie oure eye glaſſe meane frailtie mynde body certayne haue ſayd heretofore iob ſuch courage conſtancie wonderfull among men yet man may ſee taking thē ſhall become thoſe haue nothyng infirmitie whiche haue ſcarcely receyued three droppes courageouſneſſe ſuſteyne themſelues withall middes affliction muſt ſuche men quayle hand wee ſee iob ſo beaten downe whome god ſtrengthned ſo mightily wyth grace firſt let v foreward leſſon apply ſame owne vſe namely time apointed man vpon earth profitable v comfort v affliction ſpecially commeth ſeruing god walke feare awfulneſſe ought come remembrance according alſo ſee holy ſcripture ſpeaketh▪ true iob miſapplieth ſentence yet ſelfe good holy haue ſayd alredy ought ſerue v profitable inſtruction doubtleſſe ſainct peter telleth v muſt walke feare bycauſe god ſercheth bottome men harte iudgeth without accepting perſons wee muſt one day render account afore wee haue contented mortall men ſome outwarde apparance nothing worth hee ſhall diſcouer oure affection thought good ſooth ſhould ſeeme hard cace god child ſhould fayne lyue feare vnquietneſſe ſaint peter addeth ſayth pilgrimage lyfe vve ſee ſaint peter foreſetteth time faithfull walke ſort verely end giue thē ſome comfort ſhould take ſome courage hauing eye euerlaſting reſt prepared heauen may well profite ourſelues ſentence ſayd time appointed vnto man vpon earth matter life ſhould prolonged without ende wee ſtill continue ſuch cace reſt men true thoſe ſhunne god drag backe hope well themſelues good turne yea ſo long may royſt delight pleaſures yet meane muſt bee • ame inuironed many miſeries wee may haue fayre wherewith diſpatch ſelues yet doth god holde v impriſoned vvhat matter ſhould bee miſerie without hope deliuerance ſetting free ynough ſet v rage caſt v deſpaire oft thinke vpon great number greeuances want afflictiōs world let v marke god comforteth releeueth v ſaying thus vvell yee paſſe thys world life ſhort therefore indure ye paciently affliction ſo ſhort end yee ſhall come reſt haue prepared ye ſee ſorte ought mind doctrine intende take profite much ſaid chaſtizementes god ſendeth v whiche haue ſaid hitherto extendeth generally whole life particular whenſoeuer ſhall indure aduerſitie verely god ſend end according ſee ſpeaketh prophet eſay commaundeth cōforte people thine apointed time ſayth end ſpeaketh captiuitie babylon meaning although hee ſcourgeth people ſinnes yet intēdeth cōſume thē vtterly keepeth meaſure correction anone may haue ſome releaſe knowe god hath pitie puniſh vttermoſt therefore ought thākfull towards goodneſſe vvee ſee howe whole courſe life muſt fayne ſuffer aduerſities heere howbeit god prolong beyond appoynted time ſoothly ſhould ſeeme common thing though god ſpake euen heathen men meene euen moſte brutiſh haue alwayes recourſe poynt miſeries could befall comforted themſelues therewith ſaying well miſerie ſo great hath end see pray howe meaſured paſsions ſeemeth ſuperfluous doctrine god comfort v declareth time foreſet men theyr dayes dayes hireling howbeit wee haue marke whatſoeuer men conceyue imagination yet god preſſeth abaſhed ſeeming bottomleſſe gulfe whereout neuer ſcape long wee bee reſte haue skill ſay aduerſities bee great ſharpe long continuance god ſummon v afore make v feeele oure ſinnes iuſtice ſo dreadfull v behold inclozed round maze whereoutof wee ſee way ſcape ſo ſeemeth make v go euery day deeper yee ſee howe men aſtonyed god iuſtice toucheth good earneſt ſo much behoofefull v thys doctrine god telleth v foraſmuche wee muſt paſſe many miſeries liue thys world wee ought conſider life tranſitorie ſo ſhall greeue v vnder ſuch ſtate ſeeing end appoynted aforehand afterward god chaſtize v ſend v affliction well preſſeth v laſt ſo euer certayne able hold ouerlong therefore keepeth meaſure knoweth conuenient v let v abide paciently till delyuer v ſhall diſappointed ſuch hope verely euery v haue eye himſelfe ſhall finde oure ſelues haue great neede put mind thys gere although know yet forget wote meeneth wee come putting vre proofe heereof v fayth geare neuer done wee haue affliction ſo one ſicke another pinched pouertie thirde tormented ſome hartgriefe troubleth without ceaſsing aske ſhall always new begin neuer end seing fleſh nature ſo inclined ſtorme repyne let v aſſure ſelues without cauſe god forſetteth determinate time whereof mention made heere heerewithall let v marke whereas ſayd time appoynted mē ▪ belongeth god forſet v time thys may v much ſeruice vvherefore god knewe bee good conuenient vs▪ wee might well bee ſorie heare tyme miſerie hand appointment ſomuch knoweth able beare perceyueth ſhould charged ouerſore ſhould ſinke vnder burthen yea vtterly cruſhed broken ſomuch ſaye god knoweth therevpon declareth vnto v hee holdeth v vp according ſeeth feebleneſſe doth require vphild v continually hand ſhoulde bee daunger broken peeces hee knoweth well moderate weight affliction hee ſendeth v ſeeing wee haue ſuch promiſes haue good cauſe glad foreſetting time let v marke well inaſmuche haue time determinate heere bylowe muſt thereafter make compariſon sainct paule betweene miſeries laſt twincling eye endleſſe glory heauen ſhortneſſe affliction world ſaith muſt make v thinke light haue eye euerlaſting endleſſe kingdome heauen ought outway balance worldly miſerie poſsible deuiſed seing caſe ſtandeth ſo ofte tempted ouerſorowing impaciēcie deſpair let v haue recourſe ſayd heere time thereof foreappointed let v vnderſtand god hath foreſeene good v indure oure affliction befall v without good pleaſure furthermore alſo let v vnderſtande hee handleth v onely vprightneſſe reaſon alſo fartherly louing kindneſſe lo haue marke doctrine extēdeth farre howbeit conſiſteth experience talking vpon may reaſon long ynough purpoſe chiefe poynt euery v regard profite himſelfe neede surely life would ſeeme ſhort vnto v ſubiect ſo many wantes ſo long haue owne wiſh reſt euery v confeſſe life nothing ſhort thing whē thinke vppon infinite miſeries wherewith full fraughte aſſoone wee paſſed one miſerie wee muſte enter ſtreightways intoo another begin continually new agayne long lingering make v ſtarke weery therefore let v haue recourſe whych ſayde namely god hath appointed tyme diſpoſe v liſteth muſt contente ſelues meaſure hee hath giuē v knowing well woteth meete expedient feebleneſſe yet notwithſtanding euer wee ſhall fayne languiſhe end time god ſhall take v earthly pilgrimage yea euen call v hys euerlaſting reſt ſhall none end ſhall time ſet furthermore god viſiteth v euery v himſelfe indureth ſome neceſsitie ſome chaſtizements let v acknowledge thus vvell true geere ſhould laſt euer ſhould need quaile god knoweth ende whiche mindeth gyue v hee hath promiſed wee ſhall continue ouerwhelmed vnder burthen let v tarie till reach v hande aduerſities let v aſſure oure ſelues hee prouide v due time lo howe wee ought applie leſſon owne vſe meane wee ſee iob hath ill profited therefore muſt wee bee ſo much water wee abuſe ſentence god putteth mynde inſtruct v applying cleane contrarie yet ordinarie matter v ſo doe vvhen reade holie scripture comfort giuen v ther ſerue aſſuage griefe ye ſee heere comfort god giueth child vtterly bereft ſeemeth god would chere vp faithfull one ende caſt diſpaire ſeeing caſe ſtandeth ſo thinke vtterly barred hope grace thus ye ſee howe wee deale commonly behalfe vvheras god allureth v gently bee whereas hee ſweeteneth miſeries ſorrowes wee thruſt v ſeeke nothing elſe nouriſhe maladie within v barre oure ſelues quyte god fauour caſt great waye vve ſee befell iob therefore let v thinke ſtraunge ſubiect ſuch like temptation muſt remedie praye god giue v ſpirite wyſedome may know howe applie vſe welfare warning giueth v let v come treate ſaid iob alledgeth howe nowe time appointed man vpon earth true beneath men poore wretched creature yet may ſome ſort glad ſeeing god hath ſet heere continue ſo euer lo heere thing whiche moſte part able aſſuage greefes indure vpon earth ſayth god maketh none ende torment behold howe iob complayneth ſtate worſe men ſhould ſay god ſcourgeth mee meaſure hee ſheweth hee mynded ridde mee miſeries preſſe mee haue touched heeretofore namely generally wee confeſſe well ynoughe howe good reaſon wee ſhoulde indure manye aduerſities whyle wee world euerie man ſay yea wee bee borne vnder ſame condition ſame ende wee muſte thinke otherwiſe man euen birth bringeth ſo many miſeries ſo many want pittie ſee ſay well acknowledge generall termes ſo ſoone god ſmiteth v thinke hath meaſure thus yee ſee point iob alſo ye ſee ſayde appointing time muſt referred god diſcretion luſt iob without beeing caried away owne paſsions conſidered well ſaid certein ſpoken amiſſe vvhy man time foreſet iobs miſdealing himſelfe would iudge meane hee plucketh away authoritie belongeth vnto god wee ſee wee ſelues doe ſame caſe true intent ſhall bee bereeue god power vſurpe right authoritie hath ouer v ſay ſo yet meane good patient wee hold affection awe wee afflicted ſo ſay vvell lorde thy hande v ſtint thee taske thee preſent time ſay thou ſhalt doe much thou haſt tolde v thou canſt ende oure miſeries yea bring happie deſirable end lorde wee paciently wayte whiche thou haſte promiſed v haue mindes thus diſpoſed ſhal god honoured hee deſerueth • haſtie furniſh caſt forthe complaintes randon ſaye vvhat ſhall become ſeemeth god neuer make end miſeries ſay wee doe ſo one would plucke god ſeate ſuffer haue authoritie ouer v lo iob dealeth cace true pacient howſoeuer world go yet let ſome faultineſſe mingled therewith pacience faithfull ſort alwayes ſo perfect requiſite seeing iob hath miſſed behalfe ought wee bethinke ſelues well fully brittle let v marke well often god ſhal ſcourge v although miſerie indure prolonged although ſee intendeth deliuer v hand yet notwithſtanding wee muſt goe manner iob ſaye vvhat god leaueth continuall torment ſeeth miſerie hathe none ende let v feede oure ſelues hope ſayde let v call mynde determining time muſt luſt god muſte order according hee knoweth good perceiue end miſeries firſt ſeeme muſt indure yet let v ceaſe taſt goodneſſe hee hath promiſed v god promiſes lead v darkneſſe death giue v light intente put v alwayes ſome hope ſhall one daye deliuered oure aduerſities heere yee ſee saint paule ſaith although harried heere yea made skourings thing yet ſhall wee continue cace god gather v vp himſelfe ioyne v liue euer behold ought profite ſelues promiſes god maketh vnto v wee may taſt middes oure miſeries let v come iob addeth vſeth ſimilitudes expreſſe meant appointing time whereof hee hath made mention ſayeth hee looke mee vpon poore bondman ſlaue hee ſpeaketh ſeruants hindes ſeruing mē theſe dayes ſuch ſlaues afterward addeth couenaunt ſeruantes hired wage looke vpon ſlaue howe hee longeth ſhadow ſay reſt night cauſe hee neuer ceaſſeth laboring day long verie well ſuch one deſireth ſhadowe againe wage longeth haue dayes worke end haue mooneth leſſe ſerue hath eye ende terme may haue ſome reſt mee ſayth haue nother reſt releaſe laye mee downe ſay howe ſhall come morning ſhall ryſe againe vvhen vppe morning▪ day ſeemeth whole yere long ſeeing plight well ſeen god contented plague ordinarie manner men meaneth thunder downe vpon maye know doe ſay complaint iob maketh ſaying miſerie exceſsiue▪ common miſerie ſo heere cauſe man ſhould ſaye thou ſeeſt ſo long men world haue many miſeries indure thou haſt experience thou knoweſt maner god wont deale behalf god ſaith hee vttereth force againſt mee ſo ſeemeth ouerwhelme altogither compare myſelf others whome correcteth ſee ſelfe bee bottome hell haue yet ſome hope helpe ſhall deliuered miſeries wee haue marke hath bene touched alreadie heretofore wit iob preſſed bodily aduerſitie chiefe griefe feele god againſt therefore addeth inſueth immediatly beholde ſayth hee fleſhe clinged bone skin alto broken rotten behalf poore forlorne caytife yet notwithſtanding life paſſeth glydeth awaye euen weauers ſhettle whiche runneth ſo ſwiftly man perceyueth neyther meaſure nimbleneſſe euen ſo life ſaith hee riſe vtterly abaſhed ſo haue nother eaſe reſt day night although iob ſmitten bodie yet temptation feeling god iudge holde ye would ſay vpon racke farre greeuous al martirdomes felt body ye ſee alſo tormented himſelfe ſo farre thing ought marke well verie fewe folke haue bene exercized theſe ſpirituall battels therefore wote meaneth vnknowne language god viſiteth maner yee ſhall ſee vtterly diſmayd bicauſe haue taſted doctrine time place let v bethinke v let v marke aduerſities whiche befall v ſharpe tedious v yet behoueth v knowe nothing compariſon anguiſh indure preſſed god iudgement ſheweth himſelf boyſtous towardes giueth ſome token wrath vengeance reaſon wherof ye ſhall ſee ſo aſtoniſhed comfort cheere vp vnleſſe god work extraordinarie operation behalf ſo al miſeries god giue v leaue returne vnto ſo may call vpon hope hee wil pitie v end certaine caſt care trouble vpon ſcripture ſaith thē affliction ſweete amiable v go ſort vnto god conceiue miſtruſt ſhutteth vp gate wee imagin god enemie perſecuteth v ſo loſt time vaine thing call vpon euen much alreadie bottomleſſe gulfe hell pointe iob come parte altogither howbeit hee experience vvhen wee ſee let v aſſure ſelues god well ſend yet hath done ſpare v bycauſe knoweth oure weakeneſſe trie iob vttermoſt vſe ſo rigorous triall towards v owne infinite goodneſſe neuertheleſſe meane let euery man prepare himſelfe aforehande hee may able withſtande ſuch temptation ſo euer ſhall come vnto though toſſed waues let v loſe courage middes ſuche tempeſtes ſeeing god hathe ſuſteined ſeruaunt iob yea plucked backe againe euen ſeemed haue bene vtterly drowned ſwallowed vppe bottomeleſſe pit therefore let v vnderſtand ſo euer wee ſhall enter ſuche gulfes wee ſhall drawen againe ende ſo hild vp hande god thus ye ſee howe behoueth v prepared battell heart ſuch temptation come vpon v although ſeeme ſhould bee beaten downe euerie ſtroke yet notwithſtanding may hope god ayde v thing conuenient time hee hath done ſeruaunte iob furthermore although haue bene afflicted good togither yet god ſuffereth affliction continue ſtill ſpecially wee haue imagined ſhould haue ſome end thing ſhall come ſuch paſſe ſhall ſeeme cleane contrarie ſhall neuer deliuered yet notwithſtanding let v reſiſt ſuch temptation ſhall caſte oure eye aſſuring ſelues god knoweth well howe diſpoſe time ſeaſons belongeth doe therefore thinges muſt put hande good beholde ſayth iob looked end miſeries vvell alſo may well looke ſame god ſo rigorous towardes v hee beareth v ſo far may lawfully ſay vntill long ſhall holde according ſee dauid ſpeaketh ſo good ſort time haue looked whyther ſhall ende miſeries let v learne alſo beware wee bee haſtie elſe ſhall confounded vvhat done let v ſhet eye preſent thing let v praye god make v behold end hidden fleſhe owne opinion ſay let v praye make v beholde let v frame ſelues wholly good remedy nouriſh hope pacience ſee miſeries indure long god ſheweth v ſort make v way let v ſhut eye ſay well lord true thou wilt hold like poore blinde ſoule darkneſſe yea comforte meane comfort praye god giue eye beholde preſent thing alſo knowe thoſe thinges fayth hidden nowe beholde ſay howe muſt deale ſay iob doth ſee remedy lefte mee man ſpeaketh ſo ſort deſpaire muſt limit god power though thing ſeeme impoſsible ſelues hee ſaith lay downe aske ſhall riſe againe morning ſaye night let v note ſet downe ſhewe conſcience whiche preſſed god iudgement alwayes troubled agonie behold ſort moyſes ſpeaketh treating god dreadfull vengeance vpon ſuch ſhall continue wilfully diſobeying god lawe thy life ſaith ſhall hang thee vpon threede morning thou ſhalt ſay ſhall make liue till euening iob ſpeaketh temptation himſelf feeleth wit thought night long dayes weeriſome according hee ſaid one day longer whole yere yea man whole life nothing pine away onely ſome ordinarie miſeries alſo ſo horrible torment faint vnder god hand ſee temptatiō come vpon iob let v haue recourſe remedie whiche haue touched wit call mind god peculiar charge diſpoſe v miſeries therefore doth time ſeeme long v let v praye god make v thinke well doth otherwiſe elſe ſhall wee prouoke god iob doth hee willing ſo yet meane ſeaſon ceaſſeth blameworthy word haue eſcaped ſo vnaduiſedly hath caſt foorth agaynſte god ſuch wiſe ment ſpite therefore let v turne backe ageine ſay thee appointe time hand thy god wilt thou take office intendeſt thou wretched creature vvhither goeſt thou whē thou takeſt vpon thee ſort euen breake thy necke thou wilt ſtie thus aboue sky without wing let v learn walke humbleneſſe praye god may take good hee diſpoſeth v may yeld therevnto ſaye lord thou art rightuous wyſe thy doings therefore graunt v grace ceaſe prayſe thee giue thee glory namely take good worth ſo euer thou ſendeſt frame ſelues ſame notwithſtanding fleſh hard bitter indure thus ye ſee haue marke text furthermore ſaith dayes paſſed ſwiftly weauers ſhettle heere ſeemeth bee ſome contrarietie ſayth life ouerlong yet neuertheleſſe hee addeth dayes ſlippe away ſwiftly thing man ſaye iob caried awaye ouerheadie paſsions verie well ſomewhat contrarietie marke well howe according ſimilitude whiche put heere ſame alſo well placed ſong king ezechias eſay ſerueth ſhewe man preſſed hande god hee woteth although endure many aduerſities yet notwithſtanding wee count ſtill vpon life god purſue v ouerhaſtily wee become itwere dulheaded wee bee manner wee wont liue vtterly diſmayde ſaying nowe could time paſſed ſo ſone yee ſee ſimilitude importeth iob ment nowe ſaying life paſſed ſwiftly away like weauers ſhettle ſo felte god hand preſſe ſo ſore hee coulde ſighe lament ſaye end ye ſee iob ment yet meane ſeaſon hee ceaſſeth bee attached ſuch feare anguiſhe plunged ouer head eares cauſe god hild vpon racke ſeemed keepe meaſure chaſtizing lo ought apply ſimilitude hereby warned pray vnto god affliction howſoeuer keepe v wee may haue ſome reſt thinke vpon ſelues vpon ſaye thinke vpon ourſelues intent may knowe ſinnes conſider howe much time wee haue loſt life end wee may thinke ſtraunge though god ſcourge v vexe v paſſe moſt part life pampering ourſelues yea euen aduaunce ſelues againſt god therefore haue great neede pray waken v giue v reſpite examine well oure faultes ouer let v alſo thinke vpon cannot done muſt haue ſome reſt ſomewhat cheered forſo long wee bee ſuch hartburning chawe vpon bridle vnpoſsible v come vnto god comforte oure ſelues goodneſſe readie make v fele therfore muſt praye holde v awe haue myndes abyde quiet peaſable midſt trouble may befall v alſo cannot done except ieſus chriſt hande v may haue ſome ſolace according himſelfe ſayth come vnto mee yee laboure ouerloden refreſhe ſhall finde reſt ſoules oft god ſcourgeth v let v determine pray vnto may turne heart minde lorde ieſus chriſte ſo wee maye haue reſt whereof hee ſpeaketh wee haue founde ſame wee may bee hild ſuch wiſe wee may receiue god chaſtizementes correction humble v wee maye leane vnto good ſo may doubt end bee helpfull v ſhew himſelfe fauourable towards v beholde ſay ſort behoueth v bee comforted middes miſeries affliction whiche wee haue endure worlde wayting enioye bliſſed comfort god offereth v word ſhall one day enioy full perfection ſhall haue taken v hence himſelfe nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele better wee haue earſte done yea euen ſuche ſorte wee may bee aſhamed preſently come vnto touched ſuche zeale feeling bee oure father ſauiour wee maye yeelde ſelues wholly goodneſſe hee ſtrengthen v truſte wee haue vntill ſuch time haue deliuered v miſeries worlde alſo ſlauerie ſinne called v heauenly glorie whiche poſſeſſe nowe hope may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation c xxviij sermon ſecond vpon ſeuenth chapter 7 remember life vvinde mine eye ſhall ſee good 8 eye ſeer ſhall ſee mee thine eye vpon ſhall longer 9 like cloude paſſeth vaniſheth avvay alſo goeth dovvne graue ſhall comevp againe 10 ſhall returne houſe place ſhall knovve 11 therefore vvill ſpare mouth ſhoulde ſpeake mine anguiſhe talke miſerie 12 sea vvhalefiſh thou keepeſt ſo vvarde 13 vvhen ſay bed ſhall eaſe couch ſhal comfort vvhen ſpeake ſelf 14 thou frayeſt vvith dreames viſions 15 behold ſoule hath choſen halter death rather bone holy scripture telleth v oftentimes god pitieth v reſpecte frailtie muſt thinke moued worthineſſe v ſuch thing god ſpare v vſe mercie towardes v reſpect needineſſe knoweth v otherwiſe according alſo ſaide conſidereth men graſſe whiche fadeth hand withereth away men fleſh ſay corruption breth ſay winde paſſeth awaye vaniſheth without returning ſeeing holie scripture witneſſeth vnto v alſo ought ſet v prayer intent doth holie ghoſte ſpeake let v beare mind moue god pitie muſt alledge haue deſerued aught hande excellencie oure perſons nature gere muſt laide vnder foote none otherway v deale acknowledge ala lorde rottenneſſe fleete awaye incontinently ſtrength life ſhadow vvhen ſpeake maner following warning holie ghoſt giueth v muſt aduiſe ſelues well ſort purpoſe vſe ſuch maner ſpeech wit ſhould redound god glorie worſhip humbling ourſelues vnto skil ſay ala worme ther nothing mee vanitie life ſmoke vaniſheth away yet mean haue nother humilitie obedience abace themſelues god acknowledge beholding al thing cleane contrariwiſe ſame ſhall tende rather make ſuche complaint seing god hath authoritie ouer creature meete hee ſhoulde giue v taketh v meete ſhould haue let v marke scripture telleth v god pitieth v conſideration wee bee ſo frayle life leſſe nothing doone giue v occaſion murmure fret ſelues bycauſe ſtate ſo deſpizable nothing v whereof wee may vaunt oure ſelues rather confuſion done ende ſhould knowe howe wee bring thing god hee ſhould ſhewe v fauoure meane ſeaſon hee ſeeke anye thing wote might prouoke loue v ſhall find aught ſo ſhall ſhake v vvhat muſt muche god ſeeth wee bee wretched muſt haue pitie vpon ſtate conſidering nothing wiſedome mere follie nothing vertues onely leaſing wickedneſſe seeing knowe god bereaueth v glorie let v ſure haue v preſume chalendge thing ſelues ſhould bring worthineſſe preſence ſay yea lord ſhouldeſt thou ſhewe fauoure haue done ſuch thing mee let v haue mouthes ſhut reſpect worthineſſe aſſure ſelues muſt drawe licoure onely free mercie god thus yee ſee intent muſt call miſeries rememberaunce witte complaine murmure againſt god humble ſelues abace oure ſelues vtterly god alone may honoured may bee knowne hee doth v good bring doe findeth aught v wherefore ſhould bounde bycauſe hath compaſsion v hee ſeeth v bee ſo fraile life thing nothing nowe let v come whiche continued heere remember lyfe nothing requeſt good iob ſaith vnto god lord tormented heere might pleaſe thee giue comfort thou knoweſt nature vvhen iob proteſteth good holie requeſt yea verely ſo affection right certaine hee right intent yet therewithall coulde bee ſaide hee ouerſhot himſelfe going farre wee ſhall ſee better ſequele therefore let v marke alledging frailtie god ynough humble ſelues confeſſe wee haue nothing wherein wee may auaunce ſelues wee muſt haue modeſtie confeſſe god rightuous making v bee ſuche ſtate yea though wee perceiue cauſe although hee haue hid theſe ſecretes v yet muſt plead againſte haue harteburning v ouerſore preſſed muſte bridle oure ſelues god hathe iuſte cauſe ſet v ſuche ſtate wee might bee hedged manner miſeries affliction vvhy ſo ende holde v awe ſubiection vnto might haue ſayde preſumption puffedneſſe pryde heerevnto iob addeth lyfe nothing hee ſhall returne agayne ſee good ſaye take pleaſure thing god giueth men preſent life eye ſayth seer ſhal ſee ſay ſhall bee longer heere ende hee likeneth man cloude yee ſee cloude vaniſheth awaye man tell becommeth returneth former ſtate euen ſo hee goeth graue ſhal come vp iob ſpeketh frailtie man life ende god ſhould handle ſuch rigour according hee ſaye anon another ſtreine thou ſhouldeſt ſtretch thyne arme againſte mee hee ſhould ſaye lorde wilte thou fight againſt ſhadowe man maye thinke ſtraunge iob ſpeaking death leaueth hope nother ſelfe mankinde ſhould ſaye dying wee doe periſhe vtterly diſpatched doe ſhall neuer reſtored agayne hee ſayth man layde graue abydeth neuer returneth anye ſeemeth heere iob ſpeaketh like vnbeleeuer hathe nother knowne taſted aught true religion muſt conſider place hee ſpeaketh deathe men ſelfe like holy ſcripture alſo vſeth ſame manner inditing oftentimes elſewhere muſt thinke ſtraunge iob hath ſpoken according ſame maner taught holy ghoſt thing wee haue theſe dayes yet written time iob yet god ingrauen thoſe thing heart faithfull one written yea god euen yet ſtill day maketh v feele ſame heart engraneth ſame ſtill finger ſay holy ghoſte let v come backe againe article haue touched scripture ſpeaketh battells wee haue owne nature without taking hold god goodneſſe aboue vve haue alredy alledged ſome record ſayd man breath wind paſſeth away returneth ſhould ſeeme man likened brute beaſtes yea ſhould like verie deede god put hande whence commeth immortalitie ſoules ſpeciall fauour god beareth v saint paule ſaieth god immortall vve rranſitorie doe nothing elſe fade awaye oure ſoules euen angel heauen ſhoulde alſo bee mortall howbeit ſo muche god hath breathed owne power muſt need continue whēce procedeth immortalitie ſay euē angel behoueth v alſo part draw ſame well according ſaid pſalme lord thee fountaine life thy light ſhall enlightned vve ſee men conſidered ſelues haue nothing dedlineſſe according ſayd another ſentence hundred fourth pſalm lord drawe thou away thy ſpirite thing ſhall decaye come nothing nowe holie scripture ſpeaketh manner take v hope reſurrection nother make v thynke wee bee immortall wee muſte alwayes beginne thys poynte namelye knowe oure owne weakeneſſe afterwarde mount vp degree know god hath put v vvhat men wind ſmoke howebeit much god hath breathed continuing power intoo v therefore wee bee immortall furthermore behoueth god ſtabliſhe thing whiche hath put v hee mainteyned grace woulde goe decay ſpecially muſt come highest poynt witte reſurrection promiſed v ſhall wee fynde owne nature wee muſte ſtie vppe aboue worlde wee muſt vnderſtande none onely ieſus chriſte whiche true mirrour wherein ſee thing wee ſee god rayſe v vp againe glorie hee plucke v corruption rottenneſſe wherein nowe walke wherein wee ſhoulde abyde euer extraordinarie remedie whereby hee helpeth matter yee ſee howe wee muſt bee fayne come ieſus chriſt knowe whereat behoueth v looke hope rayſed vp agayne laſt day verely sainct paule vſeth certaine ſimilitudes whiche hee taketh common order nature ſhewe reſurrection ſayth ye ſee graines corne ſeeds caſt ground rotting growe vp againe nowe ſaythe hee men ſowe bare corne afterwarde ſame groweth vp againe rottenneſſe whereintoo behoued firſt turned ye haue figure image reſurrection yet muche ſay wee ſee oure reſurrection ſerueth onely ſhewe faythleſſe vnthankfull ouerlewde godwarde diſpute poſsible body ſhoulde ryſe againe ſo rotted turned duſte ſuche ſo wiſe theyr owne conceyte ſhoote ſuttle deuiſes therevpon conclude vnpoſsible god rayſe v vp againe saincte paule ſheweth ſuche folke malicious nothing elſe owne vnthankfulneſſe turneth awaye receyuing power god whereby hee poomiſeth ſet v perfite ſtate agayne ſo gyueth v certayne familiar likelyhodes order nature aſſure v good purpoſe sainct paule vſeth foreſayde maner reaſoning meante oure reſurrection ſhall bee naturall thing make v vnderſtand infinite power god honour yeelde prayſe belongeth vnto therewithall looke vpon promiſe hath made v although farre ſurmount vnderſtanding bee verie ſtraunge thing god ſhoulde make v newe agayne wee bee turned intoo duſte yet notwithſtanding hee reſtore v euen wee ſhall haue beene turned nothyng althoughe ſaye hard beleeued yet muſt truſt god neuertheleſſe able doe power wherethrough hee able doe thing according ſayde another place philippian nowe therefore let men wittes diſcourſe let raunge euen diuelles hell yet certayne ſhall bee able diminiſhe god power neuertheleſſe encounter ſayd promiſe made v reſurrection thing ſurmounteth capacitie go diminiſh yea much lyeth vtterly aboliſhe god wonderfull power whereby hee able thing nowe let v come againe ſayde heere ala lorde ſhall ſee good eye seer ſhall ſee ſhall returne graue vvhy ſpeaketh iob thus hee man diſpayre caſteth awaye taſte whiche hee earſt felte god goodneſſe touching reſurrection hee ſetteth man alone ſelfe grace whereof god hathe made partaker owne meere goodneſſe euen ſo ought wee doe likewyſe yea ſpeciall poynte well worthie bee marked moſte men abuſe ſelues haue diſcretion ſaye beholde oure god hath done v exceeding muche good wee muſt conſider wee bee beholding euer wee haue ryght neceſſarie leſſon v nowe dayes ſhall men able humble themſelues except ſet one ſyde god gracious goodneſſe ſay myne haue ſelfe poſſeſsing bycauſe hee lendeth therefore muſt homage therewithall conſider howe fauourable god mee howe bountifull hee ſheweth himſelfe towarde thus yee ſee meaning iobs wordes expreſſe man god leaue vp himſelfe therefore hee concludeth ſhall ſee good eye seer ſhall ſee mee muſte fayne continue graue nowe let v learne conſider life howe flightfull frayle likewiſe examine infirmity oure mynds ſo may conclude worſe nothing except god vphold v goodneſſe neuertheleſſe muſt hinder v magnifying god gracious goodneſſe althoughe wee knowe oure ſtate beevile abiecte howebeit wee muſt beginne poynt haue ſpoken alreadie furthermore haue touched wee muſt alwayes beare mynde although iob ſo alienated god bee hope comfort pacience yet notwithſtanding hee ceaſſed exceede meaſure hereby wee bee warned looke well oure ſelues wee ſo ſwallowed vp ſorrowe bee caſte diſpayre conſidering muche oure owne frayltie profitable leſſon nothing ought deſyre ſo muche humble ſelues ſo onely wicket wee haue receyue god grace long men epoſſeſſed pryde ſo weene themſelues worth thing yee ſhall ſee ſo locked vp grace god neuer enter muſte humilitie go cheefe oure ſtudies ought bee bethinke oure ſelues well wee bee ende wee maye haue truſt ſelfeliking ſelues beholde craftineſſe sathan thing moſte profitable auayleable men ſaluation hee taketh maketh rancke poyſon againſt hee findeth waye make men brutiſhe knowledge miſeries ſo much become ſo woode caſt themſelues diſpayre true diuell hee could would continually ſot v follie ouerweening hee woulde make v beleeue wonder ſelues hee neuer ſuffer men humble abace themſelues hinder much hee hee ſeeth hee cannot hinder men abaſhed themſelues knowing owne ſtate goeth ſhift ſee yee ouermayſtred hee ſet feete vpon men belly ſay yea vpon throtes holde ſtill poynte euen till hee haue forced diſpayre cauſe wee enter intoo conſideration owne wantes let v bee well aduiſed haue bethought v vtterly ouerwhelmed ſo wee ſhould meane alwayes acknowledge good thinges god hath done v put v beſtoweth vpon v continually togither remedy whiche hee hathe giuen v releeue thoſe wantes wherein wee ſhould haue rotted god extraordinarie goodneſſe bene let v learne knowe ende may take breath thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne inſueth seeing ſo ſayth iob ſpare mouthe muste needes ſpeake muste needes make mone must needes talke ſorrowe anguiſhe herein ſee haue touched alreadie although iobs conſideration good although thing alledgeth holie agreeable doctrine holy ghoſt yet ceaſſeth haue ſome temptation exceſſe ſayth behold muſt needes ſpeake ſeeing haue paſt moment liue ouerpreſſed hand god therfore muſt reuenge ſelfe ſpeaking ſorrowes hold ſelfe true god giueth v leaue ſpeake making mone howbeit ſuch wiſe ſhould choler ſhoulde encreaſe ſorrowes wheras thinke eaſe thē meanes vvhat permitted intent ſhould returne vnto vnburthen ſelues sometimes ſpeake ceaſſe diſpleaſe god greeuouſly impaciencie blaſpheme full mouthe doubtleſſe verie heynous cryme men dare open theyr mouthes blaſpheme god yet many alſo vtter one word yet full rancour againſt god yea bee much fuller pryde bitterneſſe thoſe ſpeake yee ſhall ſee ſome man chafe vpon bridle like mule yet ſpeake one word ye examine hart ye ſhall finde redie burſt ſpite firy rage poſsible hee might fyght god would another vnlodeth ſelfe firſt daſhe many wicked wordes ſlip yet hath ſo muche bitterneſſe heart howſoeuer world go naught vvhat done ſorrowes oppreſſe v ſore let v ſettle ourſelues pray god may pleaſe ayd v midſt ſo may conceiue moodineſſe againſte leaſtwiſe whiche ſhould hinder honoring herewithal muſt alſo labor fight whereas men wont harden thē ſelues haue conceyued wilfulneſſe ſtomaking nouriſh themſelues therein behoueth v knowe muſt withſtand let v reſtraine affection let bee tied vp like wild beaſtes haue ſo done indeuer repreſſe paſsions hold awethen let v aſſure ourſelues alſo diſcerne ſay howe shall mortall man haue leaue giue himſelf bridle▪ ſo ſhall ſtand contention god would pick quarell let v keepe v ſuch lycenciouſneſſe murmuring againſte god haue tong vnbridled ſay now▪ god vvherefore handleth hee manner let v ſo let v make mone ſuch ſort god maye alwaye alwayes honored handes let v confeſſe rightuous vnpartiall howſoeuer deale v marke ſpeciall point moreouer therewithall letall complaintes bee made vntoo yee ſee wherein men onerſhoote themſelues oftentimes ſhrinking awaye god much woulde make complaintes elſe diſcourſing neighbour howe haue miſfortune ſay man indureth ſo much ſhould ſeeme god mindeth torment mee without ende ceaſsing lo howe men alwayes grunt although vtter ſuch murmuring mouthe yet ſure keepe euer ſome ſtore ſuch ſtuffe behind hart lay open god requireth yee ſee haue conſider iob ſayth wil ſpeake bitterneſſe talke witte meaſure hee ought keepe▪ taketh much libertie nowe hapned man mirror pacience ſhall betyde v let v beare mynde warning haue giuen alreadie wit haue bitterneſſe hart come vnto god praye aſſuage diſeaſe wee come ſpeaking vſe tonges babbling may refrayned glorifye god withall make complaintes vnto goe murmuring heere wayling babbling god maye bee witneſſe ſighes grones reſort right forth vnto comforte iob hath ſayde ſo addeth sea whale thou ſhouldeſt ſet ſuch barres againſt ſhould fayne haue ſo great let ſtop iob proteſteth heere god need ſhould ſtopped ſo great violence ſo like sea ſayth hee hath need rampyres ietties sea haue broken ouer bankes thouſande two thouſande men muſt bee ſente againſt muſt bee bringing timber earth ſtones make vp ſo great breach alſo vvhale ſuffer himſelfe bee caught without great adoe great force muſte bee vſed holde ſo ſtrong mightie beaſte iob ſayeth sea vvhale howe god proceedth ſo great violence againſt mee hereby hee meaneth miſerie whiche hee endureth ouergreat god hathe neede puniſhe ſo heerein hee ſheweth hee ſuche ſtaye himſelfe hee ought haue true haue ſayde afore hee ceaſſed bee pacient howe bee pacience continually perfecte alwayes ſome ſtormineſſe mingled ſo haue wee gather vpon ſentence bewayling oure ſelues wee ſhould knowe ſo muche better wee bee true muche wee bee frayle wee maye well ſaye vvhale lyon beare wylde beaſte vvell herewithall wee looke vpon oure luſtes▪ wee looke vpon rebelliouſneſſe v againſt god wee looke vpon number vice wee haue whole bee lyke • eendes hell onely burſting boundes vnto euill vpon earth alſo mounting well neere heauen vvhen wee reſiſte god oure luſtes praye doe wee mount vppe alofte make warre god ſo neyther vvhale lyon wylde beaſt vpon earth owne nature hath ſo great violence haue wicked affection man therefore god vſe violent remedy againſt v hamper v roughly would hee ſhould let v ſay iob ſayth vvhale sea wee bee much worſe god muſt fayne hold v chayned force wee lunatike lunatike nowe wee ſhall haue knowne ſuch gaineſtriuing wicked paſsions wee confeſſe god afflicte v vſe euen violent remedy againſt v ſame without cauſe therefore wee accuſe hee exceſsiue muſt glorify conſidering howe cace ſtandeth nowe wee ſee men ought haue double knowledge themſelues one ſide behoueth knowe nothing rottenneſſe corruption intent may obtaine fauour god moue vſe mercie pittie towards v know let v alſo▪ consider wee bee ſtrong vnto euill cace madde man flingeth tormenteth himſelfe yet hath neuer awhit right ſtrength euen ſo ſtandes cace v reſpecte good vtterly weake touching euill bee like gyants huge force v requiſite god ſhould ſtretch arme ſmyte v great ſtrokes yea thunder vppon v vppon wylde beaſtes althoughe wylde beaſtes holde crueltie ſuffer themſelues bee eaſily mayſtred yet notwithſtanding wee compare ſelues wee ſhall fynde men ſtart muche boundes therefore ſo euer god ſhall preſſe v neuer ſo ſore let v bee ſure hee hath good cauſe doe let v repyne haue pleaded oure beſt wee ſhall gayne nothing needeth one woorde put v conſuſion thus muche concerning ſtreyne hee addeth ſay bed ſhall comfort behold couch burneth talke ſelfe thou frayest viſions night thou afrighteſt dreames true preſent ſaying expounded diuerſly ſayde iob purpoſed haue refreſhment bed hee found burning heate couche hebrew worde put betokeneth ſometimes burne according ſhal ſee ſentence moreouer ſignifieth withdrawe drawbacke ſimilitude ſignifieth leaue forſake neuertheleſſe ſignification burning agreeth verie well heere ſo euer man expounde word ſentence doctrine remayne one ſtill wit iob complaineth beeing diſappointed hope hee looked haue ſome refreſhment bed yet founde heate ſo much burning fire talked himſelfe heere ſee hath bene ſhewed alreadie heretofore namely iob horrible tormentes hee preſſed bodily paine alſo battels mynde feeling god againſt iudge beeing payned ſuch ſort bene burning lake paine hell muſt alwayes call ſame teo mynde ſayde good v alſo thinke oftentymes true wee ought put ſelues good readineſſe battell ſith god afflicteth v ſhal feele thing ſaue indure world warde chiefe ſithe wee knowe wee muſt come reckening god hee make v feele ſinnes ſhewing himſelfe rigorous iudge beholde depthe hell gulfes open ſwallowe v vp vve muſt haue bethought v theſe thing hande wee may know humble ſelues conceit alſo doe vtterly confounde v yee ſee iob man ſuch vertue excellencie notwithſtanding ſo preſſed wherefore example god meant ſhewe howe ſmall matter come maieſtie iudgement ſeate anſwere whole life let v apply ſelues receiue warning whiche god giueth v ſinnes notwithſtanding haue verie rough aſſaultes let v leſeech god holde v vp putting truſt grace offered v lorde ieſus chriſt may ceaſſe continue hold end yea euen till haue humbled v knoweth needfull v ſpecially let v marke well circumſtance vvhen haue thought bed ſhould giue reſt founde burning fire talking ſelfe true may well hope god releeue v v appoint either time place muſt put ouer wholly good muſt wee ſeeke reſt neither bed thing let v caſt vp ſighes vnto god may pleaſe refreſhe v ſorrowes way ſayde ſtrange cace iob ſhould feele himſelfe ſo burned talking himſelf haue told howe circumſtance well worthy marked whereas men commonly babble ſo muche making mone talking doth ſet fire vvhat cauſe wee ouerſhote ſelues ſuche ſort paſsions bycauſe euerye v flingeth randon deceyueth himſelf iob ſayth contrariwiſe ſay ſpake himſelfe vvhen man ſhrinketh intoo himſelfe ſtriueth keepe himſelfe paſsing boundes wordes feare reſiſting god repreſſeth affection occaſion ſet fyre yea ſurely ſometimes according ſayd two thirtie pſalme ſuch text yet notwithſtāding much ſay contrarie part ſhould therefore bee lauiſhe wordes complaintes euery bodye fynde eaſe oure griefe quench fire whereof mention made heere tather let v enter oure ſelues true ſometimes paſsions kindle talking ſo oure ſelues yet notwithſtanding god ſoone office quenching fire ſhal kindled example looke vpon poore man whome god ſcourgeth man oftentimes knoweth yet notwithſtanding ende god turne good poore man continue ſtill anguiſhe ſhall hee doe let enter himſelfe howe let ſay hath thy god forſaken thee elſe let ſay loke well vpon thy ſelfe poore creature need muſt thou haue offended god greeuouſly ſeeing hee executeth ſuche rigour vpon thee ende holie ghoſte ſtill make take holde taſte apply owne vſe holie scripture ſpeaking rougheſt aſſaultes doth neuertheleſſe ſet forth v infinite goodneſſe god intent middes oure greateſt affliction wee ſhould aſſured god deliuer v aduerſities time conuenient yee ſee howe iob hath bene exercized yet neuertheleſſe hee preſently proteſteth hee felte himſelfe greater heate mourned muzed himſelfe ought acknowledge verie well god haue yet inough true miſerie great reſpecte ableneſſe beare muſt yet increaſe lo iob ought haue conſidered bene point true wiſedome ſeeing hee euen ſuch courage mā may ſee ſo much behoueth v ſtand vpon gard aduiſe oure ſelues well pleade againſte god afflicteth v ſeare leaſt put v ſuch reproch ſhall know become hee ſayeth god troubleth viſions night according wee haue ſeene alreadie heertofore hee doo men feele paine bodie onely aboue faine abide temptation god againſt herevpon hee concludeth ſoule choſen halter ſay wiſhed miſerableſt death could bee leuer hanged ſuche caſe howe ſo thoſe wordes man deſpayre let v marke iob ſpeaking ſo ſayth hilde himſelfe purpoſe ſettled ſelfe hee proteſteth onely making compariſon life worſt death could happen vnto ſo diſmayde time hee loked aſore feeling ſorrowes pinched herevpon let v conſider god haue ſpared ſeruāt iob may fall ſhall tormented true god knowing wee bee able beare ſuffer temptation bee ſo greate haue bene man receyued ſtrength holy ghoſt yet muſte euery v viſited hande god ſuch ſorte ſometime lyfe ſhall miſerable death hanged ſay wee muſt bee fayne come therevnto therefore ſtandeth v hand throughly redineſſe let v learne fence ſelues whiche ſhewed v holy ſcripture namely ſhall haue matter gladneſſe ynough wee ſhall haue increaſed profited ieſus chriſt well death lyfe wee ioyned ieſus chriſt although oure lyfe bee miſerable yet ſhall turne oure profite ſo haue trouble world ſame ſhall many helpes ſaluation therefore whenſoeuer ſhall ſeeme vtterly forlorn let v therfore ceaſſe call vpon god hoping wil ende turne trouble ioy glory alſo continue goodneſſe towardes v vntill make v feele perfectneſſe let v caſte oure ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying humble v ſuche wiſe aſhamed ſelues may ſory giue glory due vnto yet notwithſtanding meane wee may ceaſſe returne towards ſeeing hee allureth v ſo familiarly beeing ſure hee receyue v time may knowe way whereby leade v thither ſay lord ieſus chriſt ſo haue knowne howe nothing v bottomleſſe gulfe confuſion may neuertheleſſe continue ſtedfaſt truſt ſhall acceptable good god ſeeing clothed rightuouſneſſe onely ſonne oure ſinnes bee blotted merit death paſsion pureneſſe obedience whiche hath yeelded vnto may pleaſe graunt grace c xxix sermon thirde vpon ſeuenth chapter sermon conteyneth rest expoſition xv verſe followeth 16 vvery ſhall liue alvvayes take thy ſelfe avvay mee dayes nothing 17 vvhat man thou ſo magnifieſt thou haſt care 18 thou viſiteſt morning thou haſt eye vpon euery minute 19 hovve long bee ere thou lette mee alone thou wilt gyue mee tyme ſvvallovve ſpittle 20 haue ſinned vvhat ſhall doe thee thou keeper men vvhy haſt thou ſet mee ouer againſt thee bee burthen ſelfe 21 vvhy doeſt thou take avvay ſinne vvhy doeſt thou pardon mine iniquity ſhall layde duſt thou ſeeke morning ſhall iob goeth forward ſtill matter touched yeſterday ſay lothing life ſayth reſteth reſolutely vpō poynt though hee taſted god goodneſſe awhit cōfort himſelfe withal conſidereth lyfe ſo long god holdeth ſuch rigour therevpon cōcludeth muche better god would kill yea ſort ſo euer haue ſayde alreadie men looke theyr preſent ſtate may bee tempted ſuche miſliking ſhall vtterly diſmayde reaſon theyr exceeding miſerie ſpecially ſeemeth god minded execute ſingular rigour towardes faithfull handleth ſuche wiſe afflicted wicked maye wee bee caryed away hopeleſneſſe ſo wee ſhall bee wearie lyfe leuer bee deade nothing comforteth v knowing euen middes ſorowes ſtill beloued god end haue pitie v giue v ſaluation lyfe meanes lord ieſus chriſt vvithout certaine life weeriſome bring nothing lothſomneſſe yea euen repyning againſte god let v marke iob ment expreſſe affection god hilde vp cauſe addeth weery hee ſhall liue euer dayes vanitie therefore hee woulde haue god go away hee ſhould ſay ala lorde wherefore perſecuteſt thou mee thou ſeeſt heere poore ſoule indure except thou haue conſideration life nothing vanitie vvherfore dooſt thou get thee away mee according haue ſeene alreadie witte god ought vtter full force againſt mortall tranſitorie men bicauſe bee rockes yet ſo boyſteous beaſts ſhould fayne inforce himſelfe ſo muche againſt iob therefore confirmeth ſtill ſame matter man anguiſhe cannot make ende gronings hauing ſayde ſo addeth vvhat man thou ſo magnifyest vvhat hee thou viſitest morninges thou ſettest thy harte vpon hast ſo greate care expound ſentence vvhat man thou makest ſo muche thoughe iob ment heere rayle god hee lifteth v vp wee little king hee ſeemeth haue fatherly care v preferre v aboue creature afterward throweth v men picture wheele fortune thus yee ſee howe ſome take ſtreyne otherſome thinke iob ment make compariſon betweene himſelfe mankind ſayd ala lorde thou art ſo good vnto men thy mercy filleth whole earth man feeleth howe thou art father thou beſtoweſt many benefites vpon none ſelfe alone whome thou art vnkind vvhat meeneth ſhall ſame ranke men thing well conſidered iobs plaine meening ſay yea lord art thou ſo greeued agaynſte men thou ſetteſt verye greate ſtore dooth hee ſpeake god benefites rather meeneth conuenient thing god bee greeued men example greate prince ſhoulde take pritch againſt poore labourer honour men woulde ſaye matcheth hee himſelfe hys equall hee doth himſelfe great wrong knoweth hee yea euen proude ſorte worlde well ynoughe ſaye ſuche one matche woulde ſhewe yee ſee ſorte men commonly vſe ſhewe token diſdeyne men woormes earth well skill alledge comely beare malice thoſe farre inferior farre greater reaſon thinke god ſeemeth magnifie men ouer muche hee matcheth himſelfe agaynſt vvhat ſtate god therefore ought ſet light ſay tuſhe well yee woormes yee vermine ſhall chalendge go fyght greatlye defacing glorie maieſtie yee ſee iobs cheefe meening furthermore wee haue marke preſent ſentence like eyght pſalme ſayde lorde man thou makeſt ſo muche yee ſee heere howe woordes ſette theyr proper ſignification iobs ſaying bee taken cleane contrarie ſaid text pſalme haue alledged dauid recounteth god infinite goodneſſe thinketh ſo vpon creature vouchſafeth haue care guyde gouerne ye looke vpon man himſelfe ye ſhall ſee ſo poore creature may well ſeeme god ought haue reſpect caſte eye vppon nowe wee ſee god onely vouchſafeth gouerne men alſo maketh lordes creature according ſayde hee hath made beaſtes feelde byrdes ayre fiſhes ſea ſerue turnes withall ſeeing hee hath ſo diſpoſed thing ſerue v ſuccour neceſ • ities ſeemeth god beareth v ſuche loue hee putteth hath vnder hand ſaying withhold nothing ye ſee wretchedneſſe pooreneſſe men yeeldeth greater beauty god goodneſſe mercie wee thing oure owne coulde prouoke v good thus ye ſee dauids playne meening thing ſpecially fulfilled perſon lorde ieſus chriſt although hee onely ſonne god yet notwithſtanding ſo reſpect manhoode hee ſonne abraham fully like v poynts ſinne onely excepted ſo ſee god hath made much gyuing thing intoo hande ende wee ſhoulde recouer thing whiche wee loſte adam therein god hath ſhewed greate infinite treaſures mercie verely ieſus chriſte true looking glaſſe god grace whiche afterward ſpred vpon member ſo example dauid wee haue good cauſe exalte goodneſſe god wee ſee hauing begonne firſt adam afterwarde ieſus chriſt whome made whole agayne beaten downe defaced adam hee continueth ſtill day v good bee made parttakers rich heerein wee haue good cauſe maruell ſaye ala lorde wee thou viſiteſt v thou vſeſt v ſo familiarly wee bee thy child thou holdeſt v thy lappe thou ſheweſt thy ſelfe ſo bountifull towardes v wee ought doo place iob taketh fiat contrarie vvherein wee ſee mennes mouthes oute taſte nothing like cace mannes ſtomacke ſqueymiſhe meanes ſickneſſe beſte fineſt meates coulde bee brought vntoo ſhoulde haue ſauour ſhould lothe prouoke vomiting ſtandeth cace v wee bee yll diſpoſed haue right well ruled iudgement god grace ſhall haue taſte ſauer v thing oughte prouoke v loue god wee knowe hee commeth downe ſorte vnto v hee dooth ye woulde ſay put meate mouthes moother dooth hir yong babe hee hath wing ſpred oute receyue v vnder ſayde ſong moyſes vvhen wee ſee god haue ſo familiar care v ynoughe rauiſhe v oute wittes ought conſideration therof ſuſfize v throughly forweeryed full anguiſhe come ſo farre ſhorte taſting theyr profite coulde finde theyr harte god greate way according wee ſee happened vnto iob▪ leaſtewiſe reſpect fleſhly affection doubt hee reſiſted pacience howbeit ſame ſecrete hidden within neuertheleſſe behooued ſame paſsion ſhewe ſelfe whatſoeuer god ment humble thereby vvee ſee howe iob turneth god prouidence quite vpſide downe ſteade cōforting cheering himſelfe therewith woulde fayne god farre vvhat man ſayeth thou makeſt ſo muche yea verely god chaſtize v whē amiſſe muſt therefore ſay aduaunceth v muche doeth v wrong mortall men man bee offended hold ſcorne match himſelfe vnderling bende himſelfe agaynſte equall wherefore matter ſtandeth vpon reuenging god chaſtize v faultes wee haue committed auenge himſelfe v hee paſſeth ſuch thing vvhat two reaſons one wee muſte bee fayne take iudge ſpite oure teeth wee haue deſpyzed neuer ſo muche would haue v periſhe therefore correcteth v end ſhould come backe agayne calleth v meanes repentance vvee ſay vncomely thing god puniſhe v preace ſo vpon v intent plucke v backe ſinnes ſhew himſelfe iudge ſhould learne ſubiect vnto vve ſee howe thākleſſe men ſith turne good turnes vpſide downe god doth moreouer lette v vnderſtand befell vnto iob bee ſo tempted hee wiſhed god awaye like temptation may well happen vnto v ſhake v alſo put v ſuch plundge ſhall quite ouerthrown muſt men bee well aduiſed fenſe themſelues aforehād accordingly haue declared muſt acknowledge god bindeth v exceedingly much vnto vouchſafeth viſit v keepe watch warde ouer life haue fatherly▪ care v wee neuer magnifie grace muche yea hee puniſheth v ſinnes let v aſſure ſelues chaſtening v wee bee worthy cauſe hee ſhoulde put hande hee ſhould let v go ſuche ſending v puniſhmēts god ſheweth bothe goodneſſe iuſtice ſo meanes calleth men repentance afterwarde hee maketh feele theyr iudge may humble themſelues hee chaſtizeth profit vnthankfulneſſe hinder profiting lo wee haue remember ſtreyne howſoeuer worlde go let v keepe ſelues ſaying god man thou magnifieſt ſo thou viſiteſt morning lette v greeued god ſet ſure watch vpon v let v ſo thoſe woulde haue brydle layd looce necke runne rouers end god ſhould chaſtize ſo ſhould gayne let v put cace god ſhet eye let v runne randon feeldes ouer ſo wee gaue oure ſelues riot paſſed ſhould become v beholde diuell would ceaze vpon v wee ſhould pray woulde carie v euen deſtruction let v know nothing better welfare god ſhould haue eies open continually ſhould ſee ſpecially ſhould gage bottome thought wee ſhoulde remoue one finger bredth ſtep forth one pace ſhould note marke aſſuring ſelues ſay ſhould profit otherwiſe thus yee ſee haue gather vpon text iob addeth howe long bee ere thou let mee alone withdrawe •• ſelfe mee tyll haue ſwallowed ſpittle heere iob declareth paſſions wherewith hee bene tempted way wee haue beare minde hath bene ſayde heretofore wit iob felt alwayes ſome comfort god forſooke full doo iob ſheweth heere ſort hee affectioned reſpect fleſh intent freendes might knowe made ſo great complaint without cauſe better expreſſe anguiſh wherein hee hee turneth himſelfe god bicauſe hee ſees hee ſhall gaine nothing men hand yet ceaſſeth regarde men yea euen much bene well gathered himſelfe hee made prayer vnto god certayne hee behaued himſelfe quietly hee ſhewed greater token fayth pacience vvhat cauſe iob martyreth himſelfe ſuch ſort may ſeeme firſt bluſh hee deſperate perſon hee hath eye reproches offered able beare paſſe ouer haue eye vnto god ſayde heretofore namely men come moleſt ſting v muſt looke vpon wee muſte caſt countenance thitherwarde foraſmuch wee perceyue satan laboureth bring v meanes confuſion wee muſte come ſtreyght vnto god muſt mourne muſte aſſure ſelues hee cauſe v feele auaylableneſſe chaſtizements better cannot bee thruſt way men marke wee ame yet neuertheleſſe iobs purpoſe ſtreyne expreſſe vehemencie affection better turning talke vntoo god hee ſayde vvell ye vnderſtand nothing ſee yee perceyue ſpirituall battell wherevntoo god hath put therefore muſt talke iudge bee ſhort one iob ſayde ſpeake counterfeyte ſtuffe god himſelfe heere hee ſayeth hee touched afore lyfe nothing vanitie ſo muche god ought take himſelfe awaye vntill hee bad ſwallowed ſpittle according wee may ſaye take breath heereby iob meeneth god purſueth vppon ouer roughly ſeemeth hee woulde pleade agaynſte god hee hath done heeretofore haue tolde alreadie hee dooth expreſſe paſsions fleſhe truely whenſoeuer god giueth men grace frame themſelues vntoo beare croſſe affliction paciently ſuche wiſe ſhould bee altogither without feeling ſhoulde bee vnmooueable vnprofitable men trouble torment intent ſhoulde fully ſettle themſelues beare pacience ſhoulde conclude meete god ſhould haue mayſterie ſhould frame ſelfe lure therefore yeelde ſelfe ouer vnto good pleaſure howſoeuer worlde go none able without incountering iob expreſſeth heere owne paſ • ion ſuche ſorte hee felt meane god grace buried tyme vtterly quenched haue ſayde god vphilde come paſſe firſte paſsions aſſaulte faythfull ſhall man woulde ſay harried away ſuche maner may ſeeme god gouerneth play horſes broken looce nay man vpon horſe well yee ſee horſe flingeth kicketh doth eſcape runne ouer feelde anone man handſome tell well inough howe tame hee reyne vp brydle bring good pace euen ſo v wee ſhall oftentimes bee caryed awaye headlong ouerheady paſsions yet god let v alone ſo rather reyne v vp drawe v according ſhall ſee howe hee worketh towardes iob hath bene declared heeretofore true wee may well alledge vnto god frayltie lyfe wee woulde obteyne ſome mercie releefe hande iob ſpeaketh heere exceſſiuely man wittes knoweth whome hee ought direct woordes euery faithfull bodye lightly ſay lorde dayes nothing vanitie ſmoke therefore haue pitie vpon ſo miſerable creature requeſt good holy god accepteth good woorth bycauſe taught holie ſpirite ſpeake ſo iob ſteppeth faſhion another maner ſtyle howe dayes ſayeth vanitie commeſt thou heere ſet thy ſelfe agaynſte mee vvilt thou giue mee reſpite ſwallowe downe ſpittle vvhy dooſt thou get thee mee hee opinion god woulde drawe away hande ſhould haue ſome eaſe yea woulde become v god ſhould lette v alone shoulde wee haue power ſwallowe downe ſpittle howe coulde wee breathe ſpirite gyueth liuelyneſſe thing ſhoulde forſake v doe wee ſee wee ſhould needes decay haue declared alreadie iob amazed man hath conſideration miſerie ſerueth v good profitable warning ſee bee ouerpreſſed owne paſsions namely wee forgo wiſedome pacience become dull brute beaſtes verely ſeeme ſo v wee marke mennes paſsions farre bee wee ſhall finde make v altogither blockiſhe ſo wee haue knowledge agayne wee haue holde ſelues bee competent iudges bee ſeene wittes confounded neede lette euerie v marke men bee cumbred vehement paſsions elſe let v conſider wee ſelues fare god pinche v aduerſitie ouerroughe v wee bee ſo daunted wee haue hart call vpon god wee cannot bethinke v promiſes conteyned holye writte remedie miſeries nowe haue ſayde ſuche headineſſe oure paſsions god ſhoulde ouermayſter aboue yea euen woonderfull power holie ſpirite ſuche wiſe wee might know maieſtie therein man skill certayne ynough mingle confounde heauen earth togither euerie blowe yet neuertheleſſe haue touched alreadie iob farre conſideration aſmuche god ſpirite god remedie grace holy ſpirite queſtion yee ſhall finde man owne naturall kinde ye ſhall finde paſsions ſuch according fleſh get thee ſayeth iob ſhoulde become v god ſhoulde let v alone ſo wee ſhoulde abyde without ayde aſsiſtence wee haue beeing liuing oure mouing ſcripture ſpeaketh wee ſelues doo ſee experience wee ſwallowe downe oure ſpittle god ſhoulde gyue v vp much like woulde ſaye power v angelles heauen god ſhoulde leaue themſelues woulde become beholde immortall creature already glorie heauen behold maieſtie god yet neuertheleſſe ſhoulde vaniſh away brought nothing god ſhoulde withdraw himſelfe full corruptiō haue force therfore whyle god gyueth v ſome leyſure let v learne thinke vppon oure infirmity whiche ſo exceſsiue v knowe nothing better god ſhoulde viſit v looke v diſpoſe v elſe wee ſhoulde decay euery minute thus yee ſee wee haue marke vpon ſtreyne certayne
