perſon one faythfull pacient man god intended gyue v mirrour inordinate affection ende wee ſhoulde beware ſeeke feele ſuccour refreſhment ſhewed v heere howe ſhall wee feele better way call vpon hath power himſelfe may reſtreyne v ſuffer v ſtarte aſide wee chaſtyzed ſorte hand nowe hee addeth immediately haue ſinned ſhall thee thou keeper men men expound though iob diſputed agaynſt god ſaying none ſinne wherefore haſte thou made mee ſuche one thou bee preſeruer men ſhouldeſt thou condemne mee ſo ſeeyng lyeth thee ſaue mee man may well ſee naturall meening ſuch take ſo neuer knewe intent holy ghoſt toucing ſtreyne moreouer haue yll conſidered witneſſed v concerning iob hee pacient ſoeuer worlde went vvhat iob ment ſhould ſay well confeſſe fault cannot ſcape iudgement god vvhy ſo hee keeper men woorde keeper hath bene miſconſtrued men haue taken preſeruer mankinde one ſheeldeth vnder protectiō certeyne greeke tranſlater alſo hath well marked whiche thing hee commonly woont doe iob ment ſay god wayteth vppon v hee watcheth v hee knoweth man ſhoulde watche one ſpie marke euer hee dooth ſayeth yee ſee ſenſe iob applyeth title vnto god keeper men true god dooth well preſerue v hath v hande oure lyfe continueth yet let hee ſhoulde bee called oure keeper reſpect hee ſeeth beholdeth wee doo ſo wee hyde oure ſelues according ſcripture ſayth ſercheth men examineth theyr thoughtes ciſcouereth thing nothing hidden lyfe appeareth iob ment ſo purpoſe ſayth vvhat ſhall thee bicauſe muſt fayne yeelde himſelfe giltie lorde ſayeth hee gaine nothing thy hand ſtarting aſide confeſſe det haue ſinned way ſhall thee muſt fayne paſſe way letſt thou alone although thou ſee heere poore creature caſt vnder foote hath neyther ſtrength power yet neuertheleſſe thou followeſt vppon thy rigoure ſtill acknowledge ſelfe bee indetted thee yet thou holdeſt mee ſtill vpon racke iudge ſhoulde holde malefactor vpon racke ſay tell mee thy fault malefactor ſhoulde anſwere ſo haue committed ſuch murther yea twoo three ſuche ſuche acceſſaries purpoſe ſhoulde iudge holde ſtill vpon racke ſuche confeſsion beholde like cace concerning iob truth lorde ſayeth haue ſinned thou needeſt torment mee racke mee make mee confeſſe faultes ſithe haue graunted thee thy det wherefore dooſt thou perſecute mee thou art keeper men thou knoweſt thou needed make inquiſition thing hidden thee well thou mighteſt ſay holde thee heere tyll haue gotten knowledge thy faultes thou knoweſt ſayeth iob thou art keeper men admitte men knew themſelues yet knoweſt thou bee ſeeyng cace ſo dooſt thou draw thy hande awaye mee withoure preſsing mee ſuche ſort thus yee ſee naturall meaning ſentence heere wee ſee howe men fare meaſure god iuſtice theyr owne witte capacitie ſeeme god paſſeth meaſure euerie blow hee vſeth ouer greate rigour although oure intent bee accuſe god crueltie full mouthe yet wee ceaſſe frette chafe agaynſte like iob hath bene tempted doo vvhat bee done let v conſider god keeper men ſaye wee heere within ſight wee maye well finde fare colour lurking hole men hypocriſies cannot keepe god ſeeyng v diſcerning euen oure verye thought vvhat got father adam couering himſelfe leaues hee ſummoned god hee ſhoulde haue appeared ſinne ſhoulde haue beene layde afore ſpyte teeth lette v conſider god regiſters full oure woorkes woordes thought although nowe wee reade inditements bee framed yet ſhall daniel ſaying fulfilled whē iudgement ſettled bookes ſhall bee opened yee ſee thing wee haue marke firſt place god mennes keeper wee may well ſette belowe take leaue leape like frogges without order prouerbe ſayeth play meece chaffe ſo thing may bee confuzed manwarde yet god marke beare awaye vvhen wee know let v learne walke • eae carefulneſſe ſeeing god looketh vpon v lette v walke wee haue leſſon well printed harte ſhall ſure haue one care wee vvee ſhall bee aſhamed afore men ſo wee doo oure naughtineſſe open daye open ſtreete ſo bicauſe eye men lette v behold alſo howe god angel witneſſes life ought make v walke farre awe greate deale knowledge muſte hold v awe ende thinke ſinnes ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed foraſmuch god knoweth alſo gyue iudgement agaynſt gouerneth common order men hath maner eye thā wee haue although wee haue confeſſed faultes hee knoweth hidden within vnknowne oure ſelues vvhen offender hath acknowledged crime euill dooings earthly iudge man demaundeth hande god ſpirituall iudge bring v inward knowledge ſinnes ynough v ſay haue ſinned wee muſte condemne ſinne ſelues yea euen ſuche wiſe euery v may bee owne iudge learne abhorre ſinne according alſo yee ſee god holdeth v ſo locked vp therein wee pyne away like poore ſoules deſpayre yee ſee wherfore tryeth v namely intent euery v ſhould knowe himſelfe onely ſaye yea verely perceyue well ſinner alſo haue liuely feeling oure ſinnes wee maye bee vtterly aſhamed finally iob ſayeth vvherefore baste thou ſette mee full ouer againste thee vvherefore doost thou take awaye wickedneſſe vvherefore doost thou pardon ſinne duste thou ſeeke mee ſhall bee heere iob returneth matter whiche hee glaunced afore witte hee deſyred haue ſome truce releaſe till ſwalowed hys ſpittle nowe therefore hee ſayeth haſte thou ſet mee full ouer agaynſte thee ſay white man ſhoote hee coulde well haue founde harte god ſhoulde haue lette alone hee hee ſhoulde ſay whome dooſt thou bende thy ſelfe poore woorme earth thou ſetteſt mee whyte ſhoote muſte thou needes trie thy ſtrength vpon mee ſay anone iob returneth oftentymes complaynt renueth ſame ofte true god ſetteth v full butte agaynſte wee bee able abyde ſuche force yet wee muſte ſhrinke awaye cannot bee wee muſt needes fayle ſoone god turneth backe vpon v wee deſirous ſtande oute continue good ſtate meane thereof god ſhoulde turne backe vpon v ſhould marke butte ſhoote hee ſhoulde beate vpon v much hee liſteth yea verely ſo hee aſſwage greefe woundes hath made cauſing v feele goodneſſe ſo wee may knowe middeſt anger hee forgetteth mercie according ſpoken ſong habacucke thus yee ſee perſuaſion iobs ſette vnto v intent wee ſhould learne deſire god let v alone wee bee ſhoulde wee bee drowned euen damnation lette v pray god hee chaſtyzeth v wee maye make outleapes hope ſcape hande wee may holde backes receyue ſtrokes ſo bee hee gyue v power beare correction pacientlye therevpon alſo hee make v taſte mercie wee deſtitute comfort middes aduerſities true wee muſte followe iob heere confeſsing god looke vppon v euening morning wee ſhall bee verely hee leaue v deſtitute grace forſake v looking vppon v wee returne hartie affection wee ſhall feele alwayes hande v hee wyll fayle v aſsiſt v continually yea euen till haue taken v vp heauenly glorie continue euer let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying wheras prouoke wrath ſo many wayes wil ſuffer v continue ſtubborne oure vice plunged owne filthineſſe hee drawe v make v cleane yea meane ſo moderate roddes may bee vtterly paſt hope may comfort ſelues hee hath promiſed god aſsiſt v end therevpon returne vnto knowing office chaunge world better therefore pray vnto increase grace v wee may alwaies faſhion ſelues like vnto oure lorde ieſus chriſt meane time ſo gouerne v holy ſpirite wee may prouoke wrath againſt v wee haue done hitherto rather making v feele ſweete fatherly hand may euer haue ſo much greater occaſion magnifie glorifie life may pleaſe graūt grace onely v alſo nation earth bringing back poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage errour c xxx sermon first vpon eight chapter 1 baldad suite anſvvered ſayde 2 hovvelong vvilt thou holde ſuche talke vvoordes thy mouthe vehement vvinde 3 vvill god peruert iuſtice vvill almightie deface right 4 thy sonnes haue ſinned hath made come place miſdeedes 5 thou returne god betimes pray almightie 6 thou bee pure right hee vvill avvake vnto thee make tent thy rightuouſneſſe peaceable better profite ſelues whiche conteyned preſent chapter muſte beare mind haue declared afore wit iobs freends vndertaking euill caſe haue notwithſtanding good argument good reaſons true miſapply thē neuertheleſſe doctrine ſelfe holy profitable take thing generally ſpoken wee ſhall finde good ſentences deede ye ſhall ſee principall matter baldad pretendeth maynteyne god rightuous puniſhing men cauſe finde faulte without queſtion doctrine good alſo one chiefe article fayth none faulte baldad needes apply perſone iob wee haue ſeene heeretofore intent holie man blame god lifte vp himſelfe agaynſt hee maketh moane miſerie whiche hee indured grieuous heauie conſidering feebleneſſe yet ceaſſeth glorifie god ſtill ſo lette v marke baldad euill cace yet meane ſetteth downe good rightuous behoueth v receyue bycauſe fitte edification like ſayeth ſuch pleade ſorte againſt god turmoyle themſelues like winde ayre true muſt leaue perſone iob ſayde afore take thing generally contayned vve heare wicked vnbeleeuers ſpew blaſphemies rayling god iuſtice ſeemeth ſhould thunder lighten woordes winde waſhe away reache ſo high maieſty god ſheweth ſelfe therein ſo ſentence wee haue marke firſte heare theſe blaſphemies againſt god muſt diſmayed therefore ſo ſhould alwayes glorifie god cōtinueth whole ſounde hee men cannot abate maieſtie though rayle full mouthe winde vanitie thus much cōcerning firſt poynt touching ſeconde let euery v learne ſpeake god ſoberly reuerence humbleneſſe ſo wee caſte foorth ſuche winde mencioned although wee able preiudice god maner meanes yet hee fayle take vengeance indeuer lifte vp themſelues ſort agaynſt caſting proude preſumptuous woordes vvhat doone wee haue ſettled thing harte holy scripture teacheth v ſame hold v true ſtedfaſtneſſe afterward wee ſpeake meaſure fayth wee ſhall onely caſte foorth goodly blaſtes god ſhall exalted magnified talke lette v come ſet downe heere principall vvill god peruert iudgement right almightie ouerthrowe iustice wee bee put mind yeeld god honor beeing fountaine equitie right impoſsible hee ſhoulde thing good rightfull well finde harte graunt god almighty meane acknowledge bee rightuous ought one muſt ſeparated vve muſte imagine thing god whiche bee deuided one another true behooueth v put difference betweene wiſedome goodneſſe iuſtice almightineſſe god yet notwithſtanding reſpect hee god theſe thing muſt need muſt himſelfe beeing let v beware ſurmyze laweleſſe power god gouerned world like tyrant vſed exceſſe crueltie lette v vnderſtande whereas hath thing hande endleſſe power doth thing yet notwithſtanding hee ceaſſeth bee rightuous true rightuouſneſſe god partly hidde v ſo wee comprehende yet neuertheleſſe mightineſſe alſo proofe thereof able meaſure vnderſtanding certayne wee cannot therefore heare ſpeaking god rightuouſneſſe iuſtice let v marke although ſame bee fully knowne manifeſt vnto v yet wee muſt honor reuerence ſayde deuices bottomleſſe pit dwelleth vnapprochable light ſo cannot reache ſo high know yet neuertheleſſe muſt fully perſwaded ſelues propertie nature god thing perfect vprightneſſe ſo faulte bee founde nowe wee ſee opinion wee ought conceyue god vvhen worldly folke ſpeake god well ſay hee ſoueraine creator worlde yet meane ſeaſon acknowledge thing propre vnto ſuche wiſe manifeſt himſelf vnto v wit iuſtice goodneſſe wiſedome thing whereby may take taſte loue honor ſerue principall poynt wee muſt take heede vnto ſhall haue gayned knowing curiouſly beeing glorious maieſtie god meane tyme wee vnderſtande thing whiche wee ought feele experience declareth vnto v ſayde dwelleth v liue haue mouing beeing mercie filleth thing wee ſuſteyned goodneſſe haue ſo much light giueth v remedie corruption cānot haue ſo much one graine one drop rightuouſneſſe except wee drawe welſpring therof know theſe thing ſhall auayle v know one god contayneth thing haue ſome feeling maieſty vvherefore ſo much behoueth v marke well ſayd wit muſte take grounded principle god nature rightuous poſsible turne aſide right equitie ſay hee forgo ceaſſe god leſſe abſurditie ſay god doth thing vnaduiſedly ſay hee ſay beeing diminiſhed yee ſee alſo paule reaſoneth thirde romanes hee taketh awaye ſlaunder might inforced againſt doctrine brought mē alwaies full venim ſpeake euill god pure truth ſtand checking replying againſt sainct paule therfore ſayeth god vnrightuous ſhould poſsible belō geth iudge whole worlde ſhould performe right ſheweth word iudge v ought bee fully perſwaded god ſo chare right dealing doeth commeth cōpaſſed rule vvee ſee ſayde ſentence paules agreeth baldads vnder terme god baldad cōprehendeth iuſtice rightdealing ſo doth afterwarde vnder woorde almightie muche hee ſayd ſpoyle god thing whiche ſo knitte beeing cannot meanes put aſunder much abace vtterly pull ſeare bring nothing man woulde pleade agaynſt though hee rightuous ſteade ſetting downe woorde god alone ioyning title almightie sainct paule alledgeth office wit god iudge world hee iudge maner thoſe brybed corrupted wee ſee mortall mē well aduaūced great eſtate authoritie doo notwithſtanding abuſe ſame full oft ſo god iudge worlde good happe election auenture ſute purchace incidēt nature ſooner god immediatly iudge therwithal seing thē cace ſtādeth ſo let v cōceyue ought rightuouſneſſe well aſſured ſoueraine rule therof furthermore haue ſayde rightuouſneſſe cannot ſo knowen vnto v ſhould able decypher ſoeuer god ſhall woorke ought wee ſhall ſee reaſon doubtleſſe reaſon ſhoulde bee ſubiect v wee ſhoulde deſire haue vnderling capacitie wee finde thing bee good whiche hee doeth whither ſhall wee go preſumptuouſneſſe ſhall mortall creature ſay poore worm earth deſirous compell god make thē knowe workes giue verdit cleane contrarie although god conceale reaſon dooings v wee thinke workes ſtraunge ſo ſeemeth oure vnderſtanding wee haue cauſe pleade againſt yet muſt honour ſecrete incomprehenſible iudgementes gather wittes v humbleneſſe ſay beholde true nowe ſeemeth v bee able preuaile againſt god ſo without replying muſt hold ſure concluſion god righteous aſmuch ſee part yea euen glaſſe darkely let v wayte day wherein ſhall ſee god glory face face ſhall wee comprehend thing hidden v yee ſee maner god exerciſe faith wit hee haue v confeſſe rightuouſneſſe bee ſuche man witte may finde fault carpe againſt ſay hee haue v confeſſe although wee perceyue haue full knowledge although euery man haue reaſon diſpute god hee doth ſo albeit ſee thing eye yet muſt wee haue humbleneſſe yeelde vnto god belōgeth vnto otherwiſe one wee would ſo farre v lyeth bring euerlaſting beeing vtterly nought haue well printed oure harte bee good beginning aforehande ſubmit ſelues ſuche wiſe vnto god although ſcourge v hādle v roughlyer would yet notwithſtanding ſhall pacient aduerſities vvhy ſo fretteth aduerſitie muſt needes made know lift vp himſelfe againſt god cannot take pritch agaynſt god muſt alſo ſet himſelf againſt right equitie el ſhall bee ende ſuche cace confuſion decay beholde brydle holde v ſtill pacience namely knowledge wee ought haue god rightuouſneſſe ſtanding ſo againſt right equitie fight owne dānation chafe aduerſities wage battell againſt god woulde ouerthrowe iuſtice bring nothing neere yet notwithſtanding behoueth v go wee bee rightly pacient ſo bycauſe ſhall bee neuertheleſſe tempted deſpayre though wee haue knowne rightuouſneſſe iuſtice god looke vpon poore ſinner feeleth himſelfe preſſed vttermoſt well hee confeſſe yea euen vnfaynedly god rightuous puniſhing yet ſeemeth ſhall periſhe forgiueneſſe bee looked cace yee ſee viſited hande god may fall deſpayre notwithſtanding acknowledge god ryghttuous good fayth wee ſee happened vnto iob true hee vtterly deſtitute pacience yet ceaſſed bee tormented horrible paſsions wee haue ſeene heretofore ſhall ſee hereafter certainely hee doubted god rightuous hee eye owne infirmitie ſaying himſelfe lorde frayle yet neuertheleſſe thou vttereſt thy ſtrength againſt ſeemeth thou arte minded heere thunder agaynſte mee ſillie creature whiche leſſe worme yee ſee wherewith iob ſounde himſelfe greeued vexed namely coulde firſte brunte taſte howe god ſuccoured middes rigour afterwarde would giue happie ende ſo hee taryed leyſure verilie iob ſome feeling hereof yet ſo combered heauineſſe hee coulde ridde diſpatch himſelfe firſte brunt yee ſee iob partlye vnpacient notwithſtanding ſet foorth v mirrour pacience yet affliction ſo vehement hee quayleth vvhat reaſon bicauſe hee hath ſuche ſauour fatherly care god hath requiſite cauſe haue ſayde knowe god rightuouſneſſe bee fully perſuaded meane bring v pacience howbeit wee muſte matche another article witte wee muſte alwayes thinke god afflicting v doeth ceaſſe loue v yea hee procure ſaluation rigour ſoeuer vſe towardes v ſo affliction ſhall bee aſſuaged grace giue gladſome end baldad hath ſpoken ſo addeth thy child haue ſinned god hath ſent place theyr iniquitie thou returne betymes hee wake towardes thee hee make proſperitie come agayne hereby hee meeneth god hath ſet fayre lookingglaſſe iobs eye intent hee ſhoulde aduaunce himſelfe play horſe broken looce ſeeing ſtubborne agaynſte god come confuſion muſt plunged perditiō euer secōdly promiſſe god doth ſtill wayte would fayne draw backe repētance therefore ought make haſte time ſerueth thus thē ye ſee two poynts touched baldad haue told miſapplieth perſon iob vvhy ſo euill cace well handled therefore let v take ſame generall leſſon end euery v may apply himſelfe degree according neceſsitie ſayd god puniſheth ſuch ſtubborne againſt hereby meening humble v might giue bridle infirmity fleſh maner licentious vvhen come taking ſtomake agaynſt god wee make leſſe difficultie wee ſhoulde incounter inferiour equall behold ſay diueliſh boldneſſe raigneth world party afraide mortall creature wouldbe loth offend anger god boldely without remorſe conſcience therefore lette v remember well leſſon ſhewed v heere witte ſoeuer ofte god puniſheth wicked executeth horrible vengeance intent wee ſhoulde ſtoupe heades bothe great ſmall ſhoulde haue mouthes ſhet wee ſhoulde preſume come pleade agaynſte god aſſure ſelues ſhall happen vnto v vnto thoſe whome ſee periſhe ſort wee follow heere yee ſee ſayde holie scripture god teacheth men rightuouſneſſe executing iudgementes heereby prophet eſay ſheweth ſo long ſinnes abyde vnpuniſhed men harden themſelues make ſport thinke ſcaped iudges hand ſhort neither feare modeſtie ſo ſoone god ſettes himſelfe downe iudgement ſeate ſheweth example iuſtice bee conceyt wee conceyue ſuch fearefulneſſe wee ſinke downe vnder ſerueth bring v backe againe lo howe iudgements god executeth vpon wicked ought ſerue inſtruction intent euerie v yeelde himſelfe vnder hys hande ſayde likewiſe text truely wee ought determine whether iobs child reprobate likelyhood god ſent onely temporall puniſhment ſaue ſoules euer haue ſeene heretofore concorde betwixt ſcripture ſpeaketh doth ſonnes elie ſide wee ſee iob made ſolemne sacrifizes courſe feaſting come doubt hath beene declared counſelled aske forgiueneſſe god hand doutleſſe woulde haue ioyned father ſo cannot determinately ſay iobs child reprobate knowe oftentimes god taketh euen cheefe thoſe worlde violent meanes hath choſen ordeyned ſaluation howbeit handleth ſuch faſhion chaſtizement ſendeth turneth welfare alſo men body muſt periſhe tyme ſoules may ſaued euer therfore may bee like befell iobs child haue ſayde alreadie muſt haue eie perſons heere wee muſte onely receyue doctrine oft god ſtretcheth arme puniſhe ſinnes worlde none v ought tremble whenſoeuer ſhall haue miſſebehaued ſelues vnto god knowing chaſtizeth v men harmes beholde ſort feele howe terrible wrath vpon ſuch aduaunce themſelues reſiſt yee ſee saint paule turning ſpeach faythfull ſaith yee deceyued vaine wordes reaſon theſe thing god wrath wont come vppon vnbeleeuers true men flatter themſelues diſcountenancing ſinnes according ſee howe theſe diueliſh ſcoffers ieſters doo cloke thys day ſo nowe dayes man ſpeake lecherie ſhall made tricke youth nature man ſpeake drunkenneſſe anſwere ſhall made god giueth wine hee haue v merrie ye ſee maner men become brutiſh ſpewe blaſphemies agaynſt god howe ſeeke nothing elſe ſhiftes flatter themſelues owne fault euill doings cauſe saint paule ſayth friend let men deceyue ſuch heatheniſh talke hee ſayeth wrath god ſhall come vppon ſhall ouerwhelmed ſayeth learne know god ſheweth ye haue verie fayre mirror oft god chaſtizeth whoremonger vnbeleeuers diſobedient ſtubborne ſuch kinde folke hee meeneth ſhewe euill eſcapeth vnpuniſhed preuent ye vengeance tarie till fall vpon profite ſelues inſtructions giueth farre thus much concerning ſentence wherein correction god ſendeth ſet afore v ende might knowe god ſendeth rebelles place iniquitie true ſome founde ſo fooliſhe madbrayned could finde harte maintayne cace wicked agaynſt god ſo ſoone god ſhal lay hande vpon creature let v learne confeſſe rightuous notwithſtanding knowe wherefore hee doth according wee haue declared large alreadie namely notorious ſinnes bee puniſhed eye wee muſt vnderſtand god warneth v ſetteth v liuely picture according saint paule ſpeaketh tenth chapter firſt epiſtle corinthes ſo ſee man full blaſphemies deſpizer god meanes abyde neyther yoke diſcipline altogither awleſſe ſee worldling lechour riotter perſon lewde loce life ſee drunkarde ſee naughtie packe ſeeketh nothing deceyue one ſpoyle another goodes god performe execute vpon ſuch one vengeance hee declareth lawe let v aſſure ſelues good warrant wee muſt dally ſurmiſe thing hee hath vttered owne mouth ſcarebugges little babe ſeeing effect matched wee ſee apparant viſible cauſe let v neuertheleſſe vnderſtande god vſe neuer ſo great rigour yet muſt wee therfore inquiſitiue ſay doth ſo know neither muſt preſume knowe ſo long worlde ye ſee haue marke beare minde wit ſee calamity affliction god ſendeth worlde muſt looke euident ſignes ende may learne yeelde ſelues conformable vntoo god ſubmit ſelues vnto yea euery v may examine himſelfe wrapped like condemnation nowe let v come ſecond poynt god viſite v world make v pine away although bee oppreſſed ſo mightily life ſhall bee tedious bitter v thouſand deathes yet notwithſtanding hee ſtill giueth v time repentance returne vnto hande ſhall finde throughly readie receyue v make dwelling place rightuouſneſſe peaſeable yea verily wee come vnto prayer bring pure rightmeening heart v beholde verie good profitable leſſon thereby men put minde acknowledge gracious goodneſſe god doth fauour ſheweth ſuffereth quite cut away firſt blow letteth alone ſtill life true ſuch languiſhing iob farre harder grieuouſer death wee ſee alſo iob looketh owne ſtate hee coulde finde heart bee hanged yee ſee hath ſo ſpoken meane ſeaſon caſt eye vpon ende god ameth vpon marke ſetteth v alſo ſhall wee finde ſorrowes aſſwaged wee ſhall feele hath yet ſtill pitie vpon v put cace man feele hell ſteade comforted haue horrible terrour feeling god agaynſt mortall enemie herevppon hee haue fire burning minde well poore man feeleth ſuch anguiſh therwithall perſon ſuffer one ſide ſlaunder otherſide ſo great paynes aſſaults ſhall intollerable true ſayde poore man may firſt brunt wiſhe deſire death ſo muche would require better paſſe throughe fire water ſwoorde according wee ſee howe lorde ieſus chriſt ſayth ſuch ouertaken dread god woulde haue mountaynes fall vpon worlde ſhoulde turned vpſide downe ouerwhelme enter conſideration ſay perceyue god doth offer mercie meening ſhoulde draw nie vnto oft bee ſcourged hand calleth v ſweete amiable voyce incoraging v come aſſured promiſe ſhewe himſelfe gracious pitifull towardes v ſufficient thing aſſuage heauineſſe ſeeing cace ſtandeth ſo griefes haue ſtill ſome hope left v ought ſuch wiſe accept good god doth v wee may feele ſome eaſe burthē miſeries though neuer ſo exceſsiue ſeeme ſhoulders able beare vvee ſee nowe howe profitable leſſon v haue witte make owne wit end know god doth ſtill leane v remedie ſerue turne ſo diſeaſes ſhall incurable leaſtwiſe haue recourſe vnto herevpon muſt gather generall ſentence witte god doth ſtill pitie men chaſtizeth ſinnes hee neuer vſeth ſo great rigour mercie continually mingled ſo ſummonings make v appere intent feeling iudge wee ſhoulde flee infinite grace mercie doubting ſhew himſelfe father ſuche ſhall haue recourſe vnto hereby man may ſee vnthankefulneſſe worlde affliction vniuerſall man hath portion rate wee paſſe preſent life god chaſtizeth v many wayes ſay euery v ſeuerally generall ſee god viſiteth v yet meane hee thinketh vpon returning vnto god number ſmall thin ſowen know vnthankfull although god call v loth ſhould periſh yet ſo ſtiffenecked ſhake warning gyueth v doctrine muſt alſo profite v make v truſt god although perſecuted worlde yet notwithſtanding hee leaueth v lowe without calling v continually vnto haue v diſappoynted ſhall bee come poynt ſo comming thither haue al recourſe vnto let v hardily truſt god mercifull v lette v thanke hath taken v preſent lyfe firſt blowe hath giuen v leyſure bethinke v ſinnes may ſorie returne vnto nowe let v come comfort ſet downe heere thou come betymes ſeeke prayer thou right pure bee awake thee added purpoſely bicauſe men cōtinue ſtubborne although god prouoke returne way ſaluation yet paſſe lo purpoſely ſayd muſt kicke ſo agaynſt pricke wee ſhoulde play reſtie iades become blockiſhe ſhort wee muſt haue forwardneſſe god commaundeth according ſayde must come betymes ſay wee muſt make delay dryuing time ſee theſe vnthriftes mocke god ſay needes one good ſigh ſhould ſay life ſleeue warranted certaine time liue worlde ouer though repentance man power coulde turne againe owne pleaſure liſteth ſame ſpeciall gift god deede ſo holy precious thing behoueth v let go ſo good cheape let v conſider worlde go alwayes backe would play euill detters haue gotten long day payment ſleepe without care till terme bee come euen ſo ſay play worldling god lengthneth liues wayting ſhoulde repent neuer thinke vpon till houre come periſhe ſhame ende may doo ſo ſayde wee muſt returne vnto god betimes ſhort heere three thing wee muſt marke well one ſo ſoone god viſiteth v muſt returne hande tarry day day till morow marke one ſpeciall poynt ſeconde wee muſte come wyth prayer condemning ſelues offence wee maye obteyne forgyueneſſe mercie hande thirde oure prayer muſte bee made hypocriſie wee muſt bring pure right meening heart thus yee ſee three thing propounded v true wee cannot diſpatche three nowe bee intent may haue abridgement whole doctrine haue declared behoueth v haue theſe ſayde three poynts well imprinted mindes ſhort let v learne humble ſelues vnder mightie hande god apoſtle exhorteth v herevpon let v conſider rightuous yea euen ſuche ſort hee ſhall execute rougheſt iudgements vpon v may ceaſſe confeſſe hee dooth thing rightfully vnpartially ſo may haue mouth ſhe • alledge thing agaynſt onelye let v acknowledge rightuouſneſſe iuſtice bee god alſo let v ſo doo may take profite wit puniſheth rebelles deſpyſers maieſtie ſuch vtterly paſt mendment let v aſſure ſelues hee calleth v home vntoo therefore behoueth v tarie till hee ſmile vpon v let v take learning let teach v rightuouſneſſe according haue alledged prophete eſay ſpecially ſhall pleaſe god ſtretche hande vppon v ſmite v let v wearie correction apoſtle ſayeth epiſtle hebrues aboue ſith knowe god calleth v let v come vnto yea euen betymes therewithall let v bring vntoo pure right meening hart beſeching forgiue faultes example dauid let v deſire clenſe v ſpottes according behoueth v waſhed may preſent ſelues face ſuch pureneſſe commaundeth let v fall downe maieſtie good god acknowledgement innumerable offence wee ceaſſe commit dayly agaynſt praying make v feele better wee haue done may ſorie returning vnto wee may giue glorie belongeth ſo wee may bee confirmed holy grace obedience lawe ſo let v ſay almightie god c xxxj sermon ſeconde vpon eight chapter sermon conteyneth rest expoſition fifth ſixth verſes followeth 7 although thy beginning vvere ſmall thy laſt ſtate ſhall bee greatly increaſed 8 inquire pray thee former age diſpoſe thy ſelfe bee taught thy father 9 vvee yeſterday vvee bee ignorant bycauſe dayes ſhadovve vppon earth 10 shall teach thee plainly vtter vvordes hart 11 vvilla ruſhe grovve moyſte grounde graſſe mariſhe grovve vvithout vvater 12 althoughe bee freſhneſſe vncutte dovvne yet ſhall vvyther hearbe 13 euen ſo vvith ſuch forget god hope hypocrite ſhall periſh firſt haue gather ſūme hath bin expounded alreadie wee haue done amiſſe god chaſtiſeth v therfore alwayes ready ſhew v mercie call vnto expreſly ſaid muſt make haſt come leaſt abuſe pacience wee ſee theſe mocker afterward added muſt sue vnto right meening pureneſſe suing importeth muſt cōfeſſe ſinnes worde pureneſſe betokeneth muſt vnfaynedly ſee promiſe god allureth v himſelfe deſirous draw v ſhould ſay men needes periſh wilfully ready receiue mercie notwithſtanding high brode way damnation therefore let v marke well ſith god openeth gate ſo vnto v double worthy damnation come vnto vve know well inough deſpayre cauſe hardning moſt part ſuch giue themſelues vnthriftineſſe make play double quit men ſay whē god ſheweth v mercie ſhal alwayes readie v ought moue v let v marke well promiſe conteyned therewithall make haſt ſeeing god ſhould driue delay cō ming vnto vvhen god prouoketh v thinke vpon ſinnes let v delay repentance till morrow aboue al whē voice god come ſoundeth heauen let v hardē hart ſayd pſalm rather let v ſaid prophet eſay▪ seeke lorde may founde call vpon neere let wicked man leaue wayes ſaid againe another text behold fit time theſe dayes ſauing god exhorteth v repentance forſlow occaſion wil ſlip away ſhall abaſh v gate ſhal ſhet againſt v ye ſee behoueth v put haſting vre let v marke wel comming vnto god ſhal gaine nothing bringing excuſes haue one worde lay ſelues god ſhall ſee hereafter ſhal haue hundred yea thouſand article againſt v condemne v let v come god prayer ſaid muſt ſue vnto importeth plain pure confeſsing ſinnes ſay cōfeſsion ſhall haue ſayd haue ſinned muſt alſo follow repentance ſhall ſee many neuer ſticke ſay god hath done rightly puniſhing fault grieuous groſſe men yet fall old byaſſe againe ſtrayght wayes god hold nozes grindſtone ſome ſickneſſe ſome croſſe make fayre promiſes aſſone god hand withdrawne ſhewe playnly nothing diſsimulation therefore whereas wee commaunded confeſſe fault let v marke well wee muſt haue ſayd pureneſſe vprightneſſe cō demne euill reconciling ſelues vnto god heere ſhewed fruite inſueth wee ſhall haue obteyned grace god wil make dwelling place rightuouſneſſe prosper baldad ſhould ſay god one men receyueth mercie leaueth maketh feele effectualneſſe mercie loue god pardoneth maner ſuch proteſt forgiue fault men haue committed agaynſt yet meane able reuenge ſticke cracke credite ſpie occaſions ſaying hath ſuch one doo ſhall finde hath done diſpleaſure ye ſee euill maner forgiuing god deales ſo telleth v ſinnes forgiuen immediately hee addeth effect forgiuing making v feele goodneſſe bliſsing proſpering v heere expreſſe mention made habitation rightuouſneſſe two cauſes firſt god grace may better vttered ſo ſhall ſhewe ſelfe onely towardes perſones alſo towardes houſe god hauing pitie man cauſe feele bodie minde verie much alreadie god extende goodneſſe yet ſo man bliſſed child cattell houſehold doo yee perceyue yet larger proofe goodneſſe yee ſee howe ſayd god maketh man dwelling proſper returneth ſpeedely vnto dwelling called tent rightu uſneſſe intent put v continually remembrance come vnto god muſt ſaid rightmeening pureneſſe whereof mention hath bene made erewhile contrarie part ſee god perſecuteth v let v know haue wood within v kindle fire withall ſay haue heaped vp matter within v ſinnes ſo rightuouſneſſe dwelling houſes ſay houſes well ordered certaine god grace would preuent v ſo ſhould feele nothing goodneſſe reſt therfore god ſcourge v ſende v affliction muſt blame ſinnes thus ye ſee effect wee haue make heere moreouer hee addeth ſerueth yet confirme preſent matter wit beginning ſmall god increaſe added nonce men ſhoulde meaſure god grace perceyue ye ſee cauſe maketh v faint harted haue ſlender hope namely bicauſe haue eie worldly meanes thervpon make cōcluſion ſhall become v beholde thing ſuch ſtate ſuch ſuch thing ſuch thing ſhall meane conſider eaſie helpe v opinion thing vnpoſsible ſee howe holy ghoſt ment correct frowarde iudgement v imagin god grace owne capacitie able ſee contrarywiſe ſayde god hath wonderfull meanes incōprehenſible v augment ſeemeth ſmall notwithſtanding wee good deathes doore ſo might ſeeme ſhould neuer plucked miſeries yet ſhal god well finde ſome good way cannot bee perceyued firſt intent alſo bring v lowe ende may learne flee refuge would become v ſhould fayth exercized make reckening ſay god wil worke according conceiue inferiour cauſes worlde wherein ſhall god power knowne wherein ſhoulde ſayd grace ſo wonderfull make v amazed deede ſayde pſalme god guideth ſauing dreame matter ſo ſtraunge euerie man aſtonied hee beholdeth looked let v marke well ſinnes ſhall haue ſent v downe bottomleſſe pitte ſo wee may thinke ſelues vtterly ſhette vp deſpayre wee muſt fight againſt oure owne vnderſtanding conclude god well skill increaſe thing ſmall ſcripture ſaith office peculiar propertie cal though ende giue v newe beeing wee haue lo wee haue gather ſtreyne nowe giue authoritie talke baldad ſayeth aske yeares olde time deſpoſe thy ſelfe inquyre father vvhereby hee dooth v vnderſtande thing hee hath ſpoken knowne bee true experience long time inquyre ſayth hee onely liue day thoſe departed long ago searche age age thou ſhalt finde god neuer reiected ſuch come vnto expectation neuer ſuperfluous vnauaylable verely ſought without diſsimulation afterward addeth vve yesterday vnskilfull dayes ſhadow father anſwere thee ſpeake ſtrength heart ſay ſuche wiſe thou ſhalt haue full reſolution ſtedfaſt ground reaſon ſhall come tip tongue well foreconſidered vnderſtanding vvhen baldad ſpeaketh father doubt hee meeneth former experience time wee haue touched already ſpeaketh old mē liued time alſo ſuche alreadie dead man perchaunce demaund ſhould done poſsible iob go bee inſtructed handes anſwere eaſie namely ment men thing bene done time accordingly ſtories witneſſe vntoo v beholde baldad ment ſay thus bring thee vncouth doctrine thou ſhalt haue made long back ſearch euen creation worlde thou ſhalt finde god hath alwayes wrought ſame maner wit ſo ſoone men haue returned iniquity god hath reached hande gate ſaluation hath beene opened vntoo ſayth ſhalt thou vnderſtande alſo inſtruction verie profitable v namely wee muſt ſhette eye agaynſt god ſheweth v hath ſhewed v time world rather muſt conſider thing haue beene done former time wee may applie owne vſe true men giue themſelues vanitie cannot gather wittes vnto applie ſuch ſtudie except god compell therevnto heere yee ſee cauſe dauid proteſteth afflicted hee called remembrance former yeares olde time bethought himſelf therefore wee muſt lay grounde namely wee bethinke v well god workes onely thoſe wee haue ſeene owne time alſo hath beene reported v olde hath alwayes bin god ſhould ſtories ende remembrance thing might preſerued meanes notwithſtanding men take pleaſure reading ſtories yet vaine ſporting themſelues bicauſe applie matter former time inſtruction whiche true ſchoole teach v rule life beholde god iudgements wee beholde howe hath aſſiſted ſuch fled ſuccour ſpecially howe hath confirmed gracious goodneſſe inſomuch although men faythleſſe yet hee reſerued ſome men knowledge truth howbeit full time yet come ſhort eies cleare cleane ſo dimmed ſhould ſee god workes deepe ſea bottomleſſe pit wiſdome minde bee well ſetled good doctrine let v learne looke foot twain nozes men ſay alſo ſtretch wit happened borne aboue thing ought bee moued ſo foraſmuch ſee hath pleaſed god ſhould glaſſe wherein wee might beholde maner hath time preſerued mainteyned church ſince worlde made ſtrengthning good men fight agaynſt aſſaultes finally hath chaſtized owne child yea double corrected became hard harted inſomuch hath admoniſhed prophet haue continued ſtubbornneſſe haue bene faine feele greater exceſsiue rigor inſomuch ſee theſe thing god hath ſo prouided prouidence behalfe thing might haue bin buried laid afore v inſtruction pray ought exerciſe ſelues therin earneſtly let v beare mind ſayd muſt aske haue liued afore v howbeit perſons haue acceſſe dead neither lawfull v ſeeke counſel god hath ordeyned thē prophet furtherforth ſeruice time peter paule reſt apoſtles prophet ſpeake vnto v day theyr writing immortall perſons god hath withdrawne companie yet muſt aske time wherein liued muſt alſo folow record haue yelded god work thereby learne bee eſtabliſhed feare reaſon muſt moue v moſt herevnto added baldad ſayth bee yesterday ignorant bicauſe life ſhadow true preſent text may bee expounded twoo wayes think baldad ment ſay ô know thou wilt eſteeme bring mine owne thou wilt ſay ſo old mē ſhuld giue ear wiſe man vvell put cace ſaying nought worth bicauſe perſon agreeable therevnto yet ſhalt thou finde olde men tell thee much ſet downe interpretation bicauſe may go good howbeeit thing bee neerly looked appeere plaine meening text baldads mouing iob inquire time paſt bycauſe looke v ſhall ſmall purpoſe true verie ſame god ſheweth v day day ynough inſtruction ſo ſhall neede proceſſe make v vnexcuſable wee ſhall haue perceyued one yeare twoo yea euen one day god ſheweth v ſo many thing remaynes excuſe v neither alledge neuer wiſt god neuer gaue knowledge ſay ſee ynough eye inſtruction ſuch ſlothfulneſſe god need chawe morſels v aforehand yet ſhall haue much ado ſwallowe downe bee ſo chawed prouerbe ſayth lo wherefore hee giueth v knowledge time paſt example deſpiſe come paſſe birth ſay ô ſhall bee wiſe ynough conſidering thing ſee life god preſidents giueth v time ſo far paſt ſhould purpoſe vvhē ſcripture telleth v euer ſince creating world god hath gouerned men chaſtized offence pitied goodneſſe continually ſurmounted naughtines thoſe amiſſe aboue thing defended thoſe ſuccored thē affliction ſeing god frō age age diſcouereth thing ſo greatly behoofe wil haue eueriwhit deſpiſed thruſt vnder foot ye ſee villainous vnthankfulneſſe thruſt farre v thing thā profitable v let v mark thing whervnto ſpeaketh namely baldad hath pretended bring iob therfore ſhal grieue v inquire thing welfare let v conſider little owne age vvhat wee vvee yeſterday vvhen men haue caſt vp account throughly snayles vaniſh away hande true man may liue fiftie threeſcore yeares yet muſt come backe ſayde ſong moyſes namely god thouſande yeares one day therefore man life dreame paſt alreadie wee conſidered well ſhortneſſe life howe glydeth away ſhadow certaine wee woulde ſo much diligent inquire thing paſt wee ignorant looke ſayde ſhortnes life god wil thing haue bin done borne ſhould preſent v ſtoryes left v yee ſee howe gracious god hath ſhewed himſelfe towardes v hath gathered tymes together brought paſſe man liueth fiftie yeares worlde may bee able comprehende fiue thouſande yeares diſpoſe put order know yee ſee howe long time ſlipped away afore floud verie well went thing howe hath god wrought ſince floud vvhen liked prepare himſelf church manner hee gouerne howe faythfull behaue themſelues whiche perſecuted witneſsing truth afterwarde faultes crept howe god redreſſe againe howe churche continue hir ſtate ſet flote ſay wee may ſee theſe thing oure eye yet notwithſtanding aboue fiue thouſande yeares paſſed true haue ſayde grace god whiche cannot bee pryzed ſufficiently ſurely ought ſpurre v well forward onely looke feete alſo caſt eye knowing god hath ſet v vppon ſtage hee haue v diſcouer time onely hundred yeares alſo euen ſince beginning worlde wee ſee baldads intent alſo wiſe wee ought applie ſentence owne vſe wit ſeing yeſterday life ſhadowe ſay abide ſo long tyme worlde thing wee ſee heere may ſuffize v good looke accordingly god giueth v meanes inquire time paſt ſo effect warned conſider well euer god ſheweth v workes paſt wey thing belong v thing brought remembrance teach v let v applie ſtories former time inſtruction may leade v put whole truſt god call vpon neceſsities feare honour requireth lo haue beare away ſtreyne followeth ruſhes growe moyst place alſo graſſe mooriſhe ground cannot cheriſh ſelfe without water inſomuch ſuch herb floriſh wither away themſelues without cutting vp euen ſo hope hypocrite ſhall periſh likewiſe hope ſuch forget god cleane contrarie ſawe afore ſentence alledged alreadie beginning chapter baldad added god mercifull ſuch returne notwithſtanding runne royot tyme nowe returneth ſayd afore namely god roote hypocrite wicked doer vſeth verie fitte ſimilitude ſaying weedes marriſgrounds ruſhes ſuche like hearbes growe moyſt grounde many hearbes growe well inough without water vpon mountaines yea euen ſhall bee whitte earth bare rockes yet neuertheleſſe wee ſhall ſee ſome hearbes growe haue propertie nature ruſhe ſuch hearbes cannot grow marri nouriſhment water grounde muſt bee alwayes moyſt elſe geere wither like ruſhe mooriſhe hearbe cannot growe moyſt place euen ſo man hathe ſap god muſt needes periſhe fayre ſhewes quite wither away ſimilitude ſet downe text onely alſo verie rife reſt holye scripture wee know ſayde firſt pſalme man ſetteth himſelfe wholy mynding god lawe like tree planted riuers ſyde bycauſe roote continually ſoked tree dooth neuer wither drie away continueth ſtill freſhneſſe ſhewe god neuer ſuffereth good menne periſhe grace floweth alwayes vpon mainteyne ende yea mainteyne without ende wee bee watered onely bee mainteyned heere certayne time come euerlaſting life yee ſee ſuche yeelde themſelues wholly vntoo god tree planted ryuers ſide ſo floriſh euer yet better expreſſed ſeuententh ieremie bycauſe prophet compryzeth partes curſed ſayeth hee man truſteth man ſetteth fleſh bee hope ſtrength ſhall bee graſſe heath ſhooteth vp little among ſande wilderneſſe vvell true ſhall bee ſome freſhneſſe howbeit ſame ſhall ſcorched incontinent meanes heate inſomuch ſuche ſhrubbe ſhall bee burnt vp sunne euen ſo ſtandeth cace ſuche freſhe greene put truſt god eyther truſt themſelues elſe haue eies vppon creature happie man truſteth god whatſoeuer heat sunne hee haue though hee ſeeme bee burnt vppe yet ſhall hee bee ſo watred god giue ſuche nouriſhment hee ſhall decay although prophete ieremie ſetting downe theſe two compariſons giue light one doo ſufficiently expreſſe whiche ſayde heere yet notwithſtanding yet text baldad hath chozen kinde hearbe cannot bee nouriſhed without water pſalme ſayde wicked ſhall bee like graſſe groweth vppon houſe toppes ſee ſome weedes growe well vpon houſe toppes good hearbes ſhall bee trampled vnder foote men walke vpon medow ground neuertheleſſe time yeare commeth yee ſee hearbes meddowes doo growe floriſh although medowe bee mowen yet doth graſſe ſpring become freſhe againe commeth weedes vppon houſe toppe ſtande man ſteade ſayde ſayde text man maye well fill armes full hee ſhall finde foyzon hee ſhall finde fruite verely man ſees houſe toppe ouergrowne weedes hee ſayeth god bliſſeth theſe hearbes contrarywiſe good turne plucked vppe sunne alſo burneth vp bee rype ſo come perfection yee ſee although wicked bee exalted bee eſtimation thoſe bliſſed god yet neuertheleſſe dry away ſuch ſort bring forth frute howe fayre ſhewe ſoeuer make ſubſtancialneſſe thus ye ſee ment ſpeaking ruſhes mooriſh weedes bee ſhort let v note profite well wee muſt drawe ſap god wee muſt bee neere vnto muſt ceaſſe water v muſt bee continuall water quicken v giue v luſtineſſe without whiche impoſsible wee ſhoulde indure one minute houre yee ſee effect conteyned nowe wee throughly ſettled beleefe doctrine certaine wee ſhoulde ſeeke god another maner affection wee doo euery man holdes himſelfe whiche hee hath yet wee conſyder whence good gyuen v meanes whereof euery man feedeth himſelfe winde ſpoken prophet ſee ſay men beguile themſelues wittinglye willinglye ſeemeth riche want nothing yet winde ſay nothing fooliſh cuerweening outwarde appearance may well bee freſhe flouriſhe men may commende v cōmes ſtarke nothing neuertheleſſe ſo dazled owne conceyt euerie v weeneth himſelfe bee better god goodly ſhewe v ſo wee neede none folkes deceyue v ſo reuery v beguyleth himſelfe owne fonde folly way let v marke well howe god plucketh v backe himſelfe ſhewing v howe bee much blinded truſting ſelues let v marke well god procureth oure welfare meanes hee ſayth fountaine liuely water true riuer ſtandeth hande watred continually grace elſe bee nothing dryneſſe although ye loke grene yet nothing yee muſt wither away baldad meeneth heere although ſaith men cut vp thoſe herbes yet drie away haue moyſture yea ſhall vtterly amaze men ſee howe ſhall bee quite withered euen middes greateſt pride euen ſo hope hypocrite heereby done vnderſtande although men put hand god conſume v ſecrete vnknowne working ſo muſt bee faine come naught except ſo bee wee haue truſted haue taken deepe liuely roote true ſometimes god rooteth vp wicked puniſhing man hande yea hee matcheth one agaynſt another ſuch ſort deface deſtroye themſelues oftentimes wee ſee eye god vndermineth thoſe haue preſumed ſo muche taken vppon ſo maruellouſly vve ſee ſaye god conſumeth man knowes howe melt away ſnowe agaynſt sunne men thinke ſtraunge ſaying howe poſsible ſhoulde come paſſe howe happeneth man ſuch plight wee conſider force god curſe let v marke well god without ſeruing turne men make onely men fade away alſo greate caſtles whatſoeuer poſſeſsions lordſhips rich haue muſt needes periſh god bloweth vpon according preciſely expreſſed namely although ſuch weedes bee cut vp yet ſhall fayle wither bycauſe haue moyſture ripen withall wee muſt alſo conſider well howe ſayd hope hypocrite ſhall periſh bringeth v againe haue touched alreadie wit ſuche haue nothing elſe ſmoke vntruth ceaſſe bee freſh greene yea owne ſeeming opinion men ſo yee ſee heere wl deceyueth v naked goodneſſe yet wee bee ſo brutiſh weene ſelues bee verie riche therefore god nobodie v lo baldad hath ſpoken heere preciſely hope hypocrite hee ſayde true hypocrite make faire ſhewes onely like well themſelues goodly outwarde countenaunce vertue alſo ſeemeth god dandleth lappe fauoureth poyntes yet ſhall wither drie awaye ſo ſhall bee wonder ſee howe bee vndermined vtterly ouerthrowne let v wilfully beguile ſelues ſay although haue ſome worldly proſperitie time yet let v ſleepe vpon neither let v tied rich pleaſures worlde hinder v looking vntoo god let v reſt ſelues wholly vpon according welſpring welfare proſperitie ye ſee imported worde hope whereof mention made place finally haue alſo marke baldad deſcribeth hypocrite ſaying haue forgotten god yea doubtleſſe although hypocrite prate neuer ſo muche god yet haue quite forgottē true remembring god feele welfare lieth muſt ſeeke ſaluation otherwhere alone without goodneſſe mercie muſt needes go deſtruction yee ſee meant forgetting god namely men haue ſelfeliking owne vertues inſomuch thinke themſelues able aduaunce mainteyne themſelues meane come god ſeeke remedie miſeries hand whereas ought haue recourſe vnto onely one time often ſhall haue neede helpe wee forget god acknowledge muſt receyue al goodneſſe hande bycauſe wee bee vtterly voide reſpect ſelues truſt owne vertues imagine purchace eſtimation owne policie preſume vppon themſelues wiſe ſoeuer theſe men forget god ſo haue pluckt office vſurped themſelues alſo doo forget god giuen wicked affection fleſhly luſtes vve ſee ſuch liue owne eaſe cannot tamed maner meanes talking making walke feare god hath worldes good man tell muſt humble himſelfe hee ſhall neuer bring rich haue made horne doſſe agaynſt god whorehunter plunged villanie man go drawe backe counſell correction amendeth rather appareth ſuch ſo caried away owne affection wilde beaſtes caſt themſelues wilfully deſtruction man cannot bring backe againe right way haue forgotten god conſider walke aright behoueth v haue god continually eye verie deede heere ye ſee title holy ſcripture giueth faythfull namely like ſayde hypocrite forget god ſo contrarie part god intendeth marke thoſe ſhewe cheefe poynt requyreth hande ſayde beholde ſuch one god preſence walketh god let v learne exerciſe ſelues heerein acknowledge god benefites throughly ende wee may thanke call vpon ſuccour v neceſsities aſſuring ſelues come begge hee ſo moyſten v grace although feele great heates ſay although haue ſore affliction worlde yet ſhall wee neuer drie away bycauſe haue taken ſure rooting god ſuffer v quaile▪ mainteyne v continually vntill haue taken v vp himſelfe make v partaker heauenly life yea water v grace preſent worlde make v feele ſame ſo farre foorth ſhall needfull v let v fall flat face good god acknowledgement fault praying looke vpon offence puniſh deſerue may learne bee owne iudges condemning ſelues may come vnto phiſition diſeaſes hee ſo heale v beeing one wee may walke vprightneſſe meanes wee may bee partaker whiche hee hath promiſed faythfull one worlde wee enioying recorde hee giueth v fatherly loue maye growe affection hee giueth v loue honour vntill ſuch time hee haue brought v glorie hee tarieth v heauen wee poſſeſſe alreadie hope may pleaſe graunt grace vnto v alſo vnto people nation c xxxij sermon third vpon eight chapter 13 vvayes hypocrite thoſe forget god 14 hope cut expectation spider vvebbe 15 hee ſhall leane vpon houſe ſhall holde vvoulde holde ſhall ſtande 16 tree planted sunne braunches vvill ſpread ouer garden 17 ſhall reach fountaine ſhall ſpread ſelfe houſe ſtone 18 plucked vp place ſo man may ſay knovv thee 19 ioy ſhall planted againe another place 20 euen ſo god vvill caſt avvay ſounde man neyther vvill hee reache hande vvicked 21 vntill haue filled thy mouth vvith laughter thy lippes vvith gladneſſe 22 thine enemy confounded dvvelling place vvicked ſhall ſtande haue declared heeretofore ment forgetting god thing ſtandeth v hande marke well vnder woorde compryſed mennes hypocriſie ſay theyr vanitie vvill haue ſuch holyneſſe ſhall bee acceptable allowed afore god let v looke walke euen though hee preſent v wayes let v aſſure ſelues cuſtodie belongeth vnto guide v order v therefore wee haue ſuche remembrance god wee ſhall giuen ſuch maner vanitie holye ghoſt termeth heere name hypocriſie expreſſe better hee ſayeth trust ſuch like cobweb spider weaue knowe spider weaues web ſtrength euen ſo builde vpon vaine hope beare themſelues hande ſhoulde continue worldes ende god au • ngeth himſelfe ſuch preſumption heere wee ſee clerely forget god wee conſidered well howe god reſerueth himſelfe honour mainteyning v bleſsing v life long certaine ſhoulde bee ſo fooliſh ſo farre ouerſeene beare ſelues hande know men abuſing themſelues vaine hope commeth nothing elſe bicauſe yeelde god honoure requireth alſo due vntoo right let v marke well one onely meane remedie drawe v vanity make v walke good way witte know god office giue mind way ſen • world full ſaid hypocriſie ſo much behoueth v marke well ſtreyne end wit haue earſt bin ſo dulled know god haue bin rouing heere haue gone aſtray maner wee muſt leaſtwiſe bethinke ſelues god calleth v agayne ſheweth v hee haue v abide fooliſhe truſtes haue v haue ſome certayne reſting poynt may builde spider haue ſtayedneſſe certaynely heere compariſon betweene reſting wherewith wee ought reſt vpon god promiſes truſt wherewith pretend reſt vpon creature ye ſee heere howe holie ghoſt condemneth truſt wee haue creature ſo find ſtedfaſtneſſe god certayne ſhall finde none therefore al ſuch giue ouer themſelues vnto creature hang vpon meane ſhutte god dores driue great way thinke ſuffer ſuche dealing hee curſe theſe vaine hope ſentence hath neede well minded well expounded word vvee ſee whole matter conſiſteth practize well knowing certaine men beare themſelues hand finde worldly inferiour meanes ſame ſerue turne well ynough ſo men yeelde god due honor rather wreſt howe god auenge himſelfe haue god enemie ouerthrowe wee laboure build vp▪ muſt reſt wholie vpon goodneſſe power grace ſhall haue spider webbes abiding ſtedfaſtneſſe contrarie part glorifie god commeth v certain thinges ſee eye fall vpon hypocrits may well bee fulfilled v much wee profite ſelues ſuch example nowe let v come ſimilitude added heere mention hath bene made heretofore ruſhe drie place vvee knowe nature growe mooriſhe grounde ruſhe ſuch like herbes growe drie moyſture leſſe place muſt needes bee ſeared vp time though man put hande plucke vp eyther cut vp mowe yet muſt go deſtruction contrariwiſe ſayde tree whiche hath taken deepe liuelie roote planted fountayne ſhall ſpread braunches boughes yea euen houſe elſe ſhall bee ſtrong houſe ſtone againe yee ſee ſome tree well planted yet notwithſtandnig mayſter garden take vp purpoſe deſtroy altogither tree good ſelfe well rooted bycauſe conuenient place therefore maſter take vp plant againe elſewhere nowe man ſet larger place ſhall haue impeachment maye fynde good batling moyſture ought tree complaine it▪ ſtate impaired rather cheeridg tree haue vnderſtanding glad bicauſe caſe heere ſhewe tree appayred ſo remoued one place another ſimilitude muſt bee applyed thoſe whome god plucketh vp doe hee taketh vp time hee preſerueth roote intent newe planted agayne may ſpring newe bring foorth fruite doone dayly ſuch time god chaſtizeth v yea euen ſuche roughneſſe maye well ſeeme firſt hee vtterlie ouerwhelme v ſo hope v anone giueth v grace returne vnto rich man hath greate poſſeſsions ſhould digge vp tree garden ſet field mighte burniſh better sunne cheriſheth grounde planted fitter take deeper roote ſo tree waxeth bigge able gather greater ſtrength ſame ſorte worketh god thoſe therefore wee bee ſcourged hys hande yea euen ſo hardlie ſeemeth kynde death yet muſt quite heart bycauſe wee knowe god well ſet v good ſtate agayne ſo wee ſhall flouriſh hee ſet v proſperitie yee ſee declared heere effecte concluſion baldad addeth god take wicked man bande fauoure forſake good menne rather fyll mouthe wyth laughter true heere ſpeaketh iob perſon meaneth doe v wit ſuche returne vnto god ſhall fynde gracious fauorable towarde fine hee ſayth tent wicked ſhall bee able ſtande god put good mens▪ enemy ſhame hee onely ſhewe ſelfe fauourable perſons bee troubled greeued hee put himſelfe betwixte ſhewe hee hathe vnder defence protection heere wee ſee ſentence well woorthye bee noted witte wee like tree taken vp ſome one place bee planted agayne another ſpeake child god wicked may well bee taken vppe rootes alſo ſhall bee continue without hope bee planted agayne wee heare threatning made oure lorde ieſus chriſt hee ſayth euery tree bringeth foorth fruite ſhall bee hewen downe made firewoode lo heere horrible blowes god giueth wicked hee ſeeth bee vtterlie reprobate giuen vp damnation therefore hee muſt ſtub vp euer alſo hee ſayth likewiſe euerie tree planted heauenly father ſhall plucked vp roote wee ſhall ſee many time make faire countenance ſeeme bee euen thoſe tree whiche god hath ſet garden poſſeſsion hipocrits mingled faithfull would faine ſort moſt aduaunced church planted haue good ſure roote therefore end god muſt ſtub vp much bee ſayde vine namely oure lorde ieſus chriſte ſtocke vine wee braunches graffed therin bring forth good fruite father manureth v feele hee hath hande alwayes vpon v make grace auailable multiplie wee beare euill fruite altogether fruitleſſe ſo god may make complaint maketh prophet vine haue done thee thou beareſt nothing bitterneſſe haue looked ſome ſweetneſſe thy hand ſeemeth thou wouldeſt choke thy maſter vvhat ſhall doe plucke thee vp ought make haire ſtand vp vpon head ſayd good quyte ſtubbed vp deede affliction lyght vpon diſpyſers god vpon ſuch paſt mending many ſtubbings vp true wither firſte blowe god puniſhe wicked man hee yet giue leyſure bethinke himſelfe come home agayne neuertheleſſe enemy god feele anye one chaſtizement worlde god beginneth alreadie ſtub vp ſame tendeth finall deſtruction wherefore bycauſe bee ſo farre amending god ſcourging rather repayre ſharpen themſelues againſt heerein bee ſeene theyr naughtineſſe vnrecouerable ſo let v marke ofte god lifteth vp hande againſte wicked alreadie ſtubbing vp v adopted bee child yea verely wee haue receyued grace without diſsimulation let v marke god ſcourge v worlde make ſtate worſe therefore doth harme rather wee bee renued wee feele care god hath v thus yee ſee ineſtimable comfort child god therewithall wee ſee alſo neede haue flee therevnto ſuccour vvhy pitie ſee bowe many calamity oure life ſubiecte dayly ſeemeth god would plucke v vp wee ſhould periſhe generall men yet faithfull afflicted heere yee ſee saint paule ſayth hope bee onely worlde ſo reſteth heere beneath wee wretcheddeſt creature vnbeleeuers haue better time woe ſtate farre happier much ſeemeth wee ſhould bee plucked vp euerie day wee ſhould bee ſo much afflicted ſhould become v wee comforte ſet downe heere verie deede ſpeake properly wee bee plucked vp god beateth v roddes humble v ſemeth ſo vnderſtanding ſpecially wee bee preſſed miſeries god ſende v anye meane affliction ſuch may happen vnto v euery daye ſome ſickneſſe ſome wrong ſome loſſe good ſome affliction plucking v vp meane oure affection take bee man ſhoulde ſhred diuers boughes tree hee ſees many well maye man cut one halfe tree yet ſhall continue ſtill howe ſo euer worlde goe afterwarde ſproute newe braunches euen ſo v god vſeth ſome meane correction falleth extreme rigoure god liſt trie v vttermoſte may come paſſe ſhall bee brought euen graue ſeeming ſhall bee lefte one onely ſparke life ſo faithfull pecke trouble hande god lifteth vp ſelfe againſt looke finde way get affliction miſchiefe purſueth ſeemeth god full bente neuer giue releaſe affliction ſo great exceſsiue yee ſee meant plucking vp ſtubbing vp done ofte god chaſtizeth v maner ſo euer bee let v bee aſtonied though correction ſeeme greeuous v reſpecte owne nature ſo deſire continue ſtill oure ſtate ſhould bee diminiſhed thus yee ſee wee couet bnt god cut braunch v muſt needes ſome gaineſtriuing ſome gayneſaying yea verely oure naturall vnderſtanding yet neuertheleſſe let v looke wee take heart affliction greeueth v let v enter account ſet downe heere yee ſee true man cut part tree hee abateth beautie one yere yet certayne good labourer owne profite play good huſbande ſhreddeth tree hee meeneth make impaire tree ſhould thriue better ſith cace ſtandeth ſo let v put ourſelues god hand praye diſpoſe v hee knoweth howe hee may make v beare fruite therefore let v ſuffer cut ſhred ſome boughes v let v fyght againſt natiue greefe againſt ſorrowfulneſſe wee conceiue firſt brunt let v fyght ſay againſt yea euen ſuche wiſe wee bee ſubdued ſay verie well ſeeing pleaſeth god ſhred ſome part v hee knoweth wherefore hee doth wee muſte paſſe yet ynoughe v ſhewe ſelues pacient ſome ſmall common aduerſitie god bring v deathes doore ſaye hee vſe ſuche extremitie chaſtizing v may well ſeeme hee intendeth deſtroye v wee ſhall haue debated matter condemne ourſelues vtterlye abaſhed yet notwithſtanding wee muſt ſtill continue ſtedfaſt ſhall ſayde hereafter ſo although god kill v yet muſt truſt ſtill phiſition heale wound alſo death ſelf therfore ſayde pſalme although ſhould walke ſhadowe death ſo long ſee ſheepehooke god ſaye ſo long hee ſheweth himſelfe bee ſhepherde ſhall comforte ſelfe therewith let v learne fight againſt temptation prouoketh v deſpayre god oure ſeeming preſſeth v meaſure able abide yet let v ſtand vp ſay plucked vp god plant v againe husbandman may remoue tree one place ſhall god haue power let v truſt let v doubt pleaſeth haue pitie vpon v wee ſhall reſtored better ſtate wee afore yea verely mean thereof ſhall man fancie alſo becommeth v meaſure god grace power reaſon let v wrong let v aſſure ourſelues power hee hathe giuen mortall men whit abated himſelfe hath much without compariſon ſo letted ayde v greateſt aduerſities vvhen calamity ſhall bee vtterly deadlye hee reſtore v agayne ſuche wiſe wee ſhall haue whereof reioyce nowe remayneth applied owne vſe haue touched afore wee ſee ſtate preſent life euery man ought looke himſelfe man whiche skill complayne whiche maketh moanes leaſt wyſe whiche though hee vtter mouth dothe keepe locked vp ſorrowe ſo hee ſayeth ſelfe ala ſuche inconuenience befalne mee worſe god hath diminiſhed mee ſo much vvee skill well ynoughe bethinke v theſe thing diuell alſo miſſe put oure heades wee myghte bee greeued tormented yea euen fret fume againſte god vvhat bee done beholde heere meane beate backe ſuche temptation witte conſider god worke ſuche manner towardes ſhall turne theyr welfare ſhall make theyr profite euen aduauntage ſeemed tende theyr deſtruction heere yee ſee euen kynd temptation ſet v firſt bluſh ſeemed moſt ſtraunge griſlye mention made plucking vp roote ye ſee tree dead quite cleane diſpatched wherein cō ſiſteth life tree roote earth taken awaye lyfe v god take v belongeth preſent life ye ſee wee bee plucked vp roote hope v imagine life conſiſteth hauing goodes hauing wherewith ſuſteyne cheriſh ſelues yet wee tree tree contented hauing ſo much roome roote able occupie man hath inſatiable luſt bee gulfes ſo much thinke whole worlde ynoughe fynde v ſuche haue fieldes houſes vineyardes heritage afrayde ſtill ſhoulde wante earth haue money purſe afrayde doubte yea continuallye martyred feare leaſte god ſhould diſappoint pray abate portion seeing oure deſyres reached ſo farre onely roote tree alſo without ſtint meaſure proofe heereof ſo ſobre hold ourſelues holy ghoſt calleth v greatly oure behoofe lette v marke well althoughe ſeeme oure life continue without ordinarie mean god hath allotted yet notwithſtanding able ſend v meanes wherethrough wee ſhall eſcape hee giue v day morrowe true thing ſhall ſeeme eaſie vnto v neuertheleſſe ynough god prouide yea hee ſet ſuch order ſhall haue cauſe magnifie infinite power wiſedome working ſuche maner v incomprehenſible ye ſee ſay ſtandeth v hand practiſe ſentence euery v findeth himſelfe ſuch perplexity maye ſay ala muſt become ſee goodes miniſhed ſee ſhut ſuch meanes trade diminiſhed vvell god hath cut yet muſt needes ſay whiche hee hath cut ſuperfluous mee behooueth profite ſelfe thereby ſawe behooued mee pray vnto god nowe hee ſheweth ſo wee muſte alwayes conclude withoute cauſe ſo cutteth thing knoweth bee ſuperfluous v meane whyle let v prepare ſelues plucked vp chiefe poynt many awaye meane affliction god diminiſh ſhew themſelues conſtante ſo muche manne ſhall ſee outrageouſe vaine glorie ouervnruly couetouſneſſe take whiche lefte holde themſelues contented thanking god keeping ſelues quiet bee pinched ſomewhat neere quicke ſpecially ſo ſeeme god mynded make cleane riddance ſhall yee fynde vtterly wittes bycauſe prepared ought indure battell ſpoken heere witte bee vtterlie plucked vp ynoughe v ſuffer god cut boughes ſhred braunches twigges knoweth bee ſuperfluous v alſo plucke v vp rootes hath authoritie ouer v wee ſhall gayne nothing reſiſting yet neuertheleſſe great profite wee ſhould hope hee plant v agayne meane giue roome mercie contrarie withſtande god grace ſo hee voutſafeth ſet v vp againe hee ſees ſcourging v make v thinke oure ſelues vtterlie forlorne paſt recouerie anye freſheneſſe agayne one wee ſhould cut god hande ſay hee planteth v agayne true power ſhall bee leſſened throughe vnbeleefe worthy feele enioy ſo great benefite ye ſee whereto muſt come witte euery v muſt diſpoſe ſelfe bee plucked vp roote ſay god ſmyte v parte afterward pleaſe ſmite v whole perſons wiues child honoure euer haue ſuch wiſe become yee would ſay wretched darkneſſe ſo wee haue ſo much one ſparke life yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt abyde quietly beholde thing ſurmounteth worldly power confeſſe doubt menne inforce themſelues therevnto owne accorde wee muſt deſire god worke v intent hee maye ſuch wiſe diſpoſe oure life may ready liue dye pleaſure therefore muſt pray giue v ſuch manner ſtrength doubt thing written ſhall bee fulfilled god meant diſappoint v hope likened v tree planted afterward taken vp ende planted better place howbeit true wee ſhall alwayes planted againe reſpect worlde may well bee wee ſhall continue plucked vp yea ſhal ſeeme god hath euen caſt v away iudge ſtate may ſay farewell good dayes god mynded haue pitie vpon mee hee woulde haue lingered dryuen ſo long time ſo much ſee hee letteth rotte miſerie token neuer ſet vp agayne lo wee may ſay neuertheleſſe let v call mynd god meaneth trie faythe holding v hope heuenly life hidden v although god bliſſe ſeruants giue ſome proſperitie worlde bee ſayde laſt ſtate better planting v churche intente wee ſhoulde liue kingdome euerlaſtingly without ende nowe oure true reſurrection renewment euen god ſhould reſerue v ſet v kingdome hee hath made v wayfare worlde paſſe fire water affliction wee may ende exempted miſeries world made partaker life glorie ſo let v beare mynd howe saint paule ſayth vnto v life hiddē ieſus chriſt ſhal notſee true perfecte manifeſtation vntill lord ieſus come heauen bee ſhort let v marke one ſimilitude wee ought bee well acquainted truely winter time tree ſeeme deade ſee howe raine doth rotte ſo ſwolne bee readie burſt thus yee ſee well one kynde rottenneſſe afterwarde commeth froſt ſeare drie vp vvee ſee theſe thing ſee ſo much one floure cutting v beholde heere kynd death laſteth daye twayne foure fine moneths neuertheleſſe although life tree vnſeene yet ſap roote hart wood euen ſo v life alſo hidden howe ſelues poore kind hiding ſhould need great froſt ſterue vp great wet marre carrie fire froſt ynough ſelues conſume life hidden god hee keeper wee knowe ieſus chriſt partie whome wee drawe life let v content ſelues ſayde headdineſſe true man take vp tree purpoſe ſet againe hee neede make haſt tree tarrie anye long time aboue grounde neuer take roote though bee planted newe againe god hathe manner power laborer earth haue neuertheleſſe wee ſee ſometimes men cunning well keepe tree aliue time laye ſhadie place nother wynde ſunne ſhall come drye ſo ſappe ſhall alwayes bee kepte cloſe men fynde ſome meanes although cannot ſaue liues tree euer yet helpe ſome ſorte let v thinke god liſteth keepe v vnplanted long time hee preſerue v yea euen ſuch wiſe ſhall hard make v take roote newe againe ſo euer pleaſeth yee ſee wee haue beare mynde thing wherein euery one v muſt exerciſe himſelfe giue whole mynde may profite ſelues ſimilitude ſpoken heere conclude confirme matter behoueth v marke well ſayd namely god neuer lend hand wicked contrariwiſe put enemy good men ſhame haue pitie th▪ good men continually verely wee ſhould put god ſtint ſay reſpect preſent life hee ſhould behaue himſelfe ſuch ſorte towardes v wee ſhould alwayes bee bliſſed hande continue alwayes proſperitie doctrine falſe alſo haue recordes ynowe scripture god hold ſuch rule whoſe father ſauiour ſhould liue eaſe reſt verie deede expedient v example theſe day good men handled gentlie god hande thing wiſh deſire wicked puniſhed roughly hoping latter daye wee ſhould fall ſo ſound aſleepe cace nothing ſhould▪ needefull lord ieſus chriſt ſhould appeate iudge world ſo god iudgementes ſhould bee altogither apparaunt ſhould none hope ſaluation vvee ſee although god ſuffer thing bee confuſed worlde ſo good folke tormented vttermoſte wicked folke aduaunced triumphe yet wee bee ſo drouzie ſo dulheaded wee bee moued come vnto god conſider ſayth v namely life hidden yet wee muſte tarrie till bee reuealed comming ieſus chriſt vvee attaine conſideration meanes although god prouoke v drawe v force vvhat would god diſpoſed mannes life ſuch wiſe well ordered man indured anye aduerſitie men might ſay behold god aydeth good therewithall ſhewing himſelfe enemie bad beare ſuffer certayne wee would make heauen heere wee would conclude fondneſſe waite comming chriſt bee looked wee ſee profite god ſhould nowe vphold v ordinarie vnpartiall maner ſhew himſelfe fauourable faithfull puniſhe naughtipacks rather ſhould ſeeme diſſemble time wicked ouerſhoote themſelues working diſpleaſure nothing elſe mocking vvell ſeemeth god ſleepe rather hee able repreſſe wycked muſte ruffle oute haue better hande tyme contrarie good troubled tormented god muſte ſuccoure muſte ſyghe crye vpon ſeemes bee vayne heard effecte would ſhewe good therefore thing ſhould goe ſo none reaſon haue alledged alreadie inough muſt alſo rehearſe text scripture ſayd faythe muche precious corruptible metalles ſo golde ſyluer muſte paſſe fyre bee fyned droſſe oure fayth muſte alſo bee tryed ſo muche thorrowlye precious god howe ſhall done affliction marke wee haue note may fare better texte god lendeth hande wicked fauouring ſhewing ſelfe bee friende contrarie hee ſhewe loue towards faithfull firſt ſuffereth languiſhe ſuche wiſe bee trampled vnder foote likelyhoode euer ſhould bee ſet vp againe god maye well doe theſe thinges yet meane whyle ceaſſeth fulfill conteyned heere witte hee reacheth hande vnto wicked goodes whiche haue euer delight glorye muſt euery whit turne confuſion wee perceyue excepte wee gyue eare whiche ſpoken v holie scripture vvhen ſhall haue harkened heare god vttereth hee giue v eye behold hidden v behold sauioure ieſus chriſte cryeth wo bee laugh nowe yee ſhall weepe vvo bee ruffle muſt likewyſe bee tormented ſo ſhall pay deere ioyes lo scripture auoucheth behoueth v receyue ſpoken throughly reſolued wee haue doone god honour giue credite worde hee make v vnderſtande men perceyue namely middes greateſt aduerſitie heauineſſe betide v haue ſtill cauſe laugh ſay comfort cheere ſelues bycauſe haue eye happie ende god promiſeth notwithſtanding ſame bee perceyued earthly eye vnderſtanding neuertheleſſe certayne god fauoureth wicked bycauſe althoughe haue neuer ſo muche proſperitie although flouriſh neuer ſo much outward appearance yet turned ruine confuſion contrariwiſe though faithfull ſcourged tormented many wayes yet notwithſtanding muche bee vphild hande god▪ neuer miſcarie turneth welfare profit herein ſee thing accompliſhed conteyned heere bee ſhort ſee haue marke vpon texte let v learne put truſt worlde inferiour meanes heere belowe let v leane vnto god ſeeing hee hath giuen v lorde ieſus chriſt end graffed may drayne ſuch ſtrength ſap although life bee hidden ſo wee bee euen death may ceaſſe continue ſtill maynteined good ſure ſtate wayting till good god haue deliuered v worldly miſeries oute trouble wee bee fayne ſuffer heere vntill hee call v bring v kingdome heauen glorie hath purchaſed precious bloud lord ieſus chriſt nowe let v fall flat preſence oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceiue better wee haue done therewithall wee maye haue oure recourſe vnto knowing howe onely amend v euill affection therefore maye pleaſe drawe v backe ſuche wiſe forſaking ſelues worlde wee maye laboure heauenly life vntill ſuche time hauing ouercome aduerſitie preſent life beeing come ende battels wherewyth wee aſſayled may fully enioy victory whiche giueth v nowe grace holye ſpirite may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation earth c xxxiij sermon first vpon ninth chapter iob anſvvered ſayd 2 truth knovv man ſhall bee iuſtified godvvard 3 vvould diſpute vvith ſhould anſvvere one poynt thouſand 4 vviſe hart mightie ſtrength vvho ſhall ſet ſelfe againſt haue peace 5 hee remoueth mountaynes feele vvhen hee ouerthrovveth hys vvrath 6 remoueth earth hir place pillers thereof quake although men bee enforced confeſſe god righteous fault founde yet notwithſtanding paſsions ſo outrageous afflicted man ſhal heare thoſe ſo ſmitten onely grudge againſte god alſo blaſpheme full mouthe yet torment neuer leſſe ſeemeth reuenge ſelues ſorte ſo rayle againſt whome haue doe muche therefore behooueth v bethinke v god righteouſneſſe great whyle aforehand ende ſcourgeth v may alwayes abyde lowlineſſe knowe witte hee ryghteouſe vnblameable neuertheleſſe whole matter conſiſteth onely confeſsing generally god ryghteouſe wee haue ſeene heeretofore baldad mainteining ſayd cace god rightuous wreſted euill faſhion ſtaying vppon thys poynte namely god puniſheth men according deſert wee haue ſeene alreadie rule holdeth continually alike god doth ſomtimes ſpare wicked beare ſometimes hee chaſtizeth thoſe whome hee loueth handeleth much rigorouſly thoſe vtterly paſt amendment wee deeme god chaſtizeth euery man according deſertes ſhall become men couet maynteine rightuouſneſſe meanes take wrong way yee ſee fault men take vpon meaſure god iuſtice ſay hee puniſheth man ſinnes yea looke manner quantitie euerye one hath offended thereafter muſte god paye home worlde take god iuſtice ought doe reſpecte iob treateth nowe muche better manner god iuſtice howe • knowne baldad hath done wit without hauing reſpecte one ſinne onely taking menne bee moothers wombe yet notwithſtanding whole worlde muſte needes bee condemned afore god apparant althoughe affliction ſeeme roughe yet notwithſtanding god reproued let v marke well two diuers maners ſpeeche ſaye god rightuous puniſheth men according deſerte ſay god rightuous ſo euer hee handleth men yet muſt wee alwayes keepe oure mouthes ſhet grudge againſt bycauſe wee gaine thing thereby wee ſee wicked man puniſhed god hand haue touched afore god meaning men ſhould knowe particular iudgement hee executeth ende men ſhould bee warned holie scripture ſpeaketh ſame manner vvee ſee god puniſheth whoredomes cruelty periuries blaſphemies ſuche like thinges yea verelie eyther vpon men perſons elſe vpon country vppon ſome place ſhall haue bene giuen ſome crime vvhen god layeth hande vpon ſuche therein hee ſheweth mirrour inſtructe v according paule ſpeaketh hee ſayeth god puniſheth ſinners intent euery man ſhoulde beware hee puniſheth rebellion againſt worde make v walke feare vvhen hee puniſheth wicked luſtes holde v awe vvhen hee puniſheth whoredomes ende wee ſhoulde walke cleanlineſſe bothe bodie ſoule thus yee ſee howe god menne ſhould behold conſider iudgements ſpecially bee manyfeſt man may well ſaye ſometimes god righteous hee hath puniſhed ſuche one yea euen bycauſe hee man wicked diſſolute life hee hath executed vengeance vpon ſuch countrie full filthyneſſe vncleanneſſe vvee may well ſpeake maner ſo ought wee doe howe bee alwayes haue ſayde alreadie hee holdeth one rule vvhat bee done vvee muſt come vp higher ſaye god alwayes righteous howe ſo euer hee handle men poynte well worthie bee noted theſe dayes wee ſhall ſee ſome beaſtes notwithſtanding weene themſelues bee clearkly fellowes ſhall haue maynteined god iuſtice owne reaſon phantaſticall wit would god ſhould bee eſteemed righteous handling euerie man according deſertes touched afore bring paſſe fayne graunt free god election muſt ouerthrowne brought naught ſaye god choſeth whome hee liſteth calleth ſaluation owne free goodneſſe hee forſaketh reſidue thinke verie ſtraunge bee ſpoken bycauſe comprehende reaſon heere yee ſee theſe rogue counterfaite bee great clearkes ouerturne foundacions fayth proue god rightuouſneſſe euen owne fanſie cauſe mount ſo hygh knowe god rightuous compariſon men whatſoeuer true ſtādeth v hād beware another extremitie faultie ſhal ſee ſome ſlaunderous conuerſation may perceiue leudneſſe diſcouered fall ſaying honeſt man yea worldward confeſſe euery man ſinner godward ſo ſhroude himſelfe vnder common cloake looke vpon whorehunter hathe haunted ſtewes halfe ſcore yeares looke vpon blaſphemer ceaſſeth rayle god ſpyte hym looke vpon villaine deſpiſeth god religion looke vpon vnthrifte vnconſcionable perſon ſeeketh nought elſe catching withoute faithfulneſſe honeſt dealing ſuch dogges ſay true ſinners god manne righteous goe faultes ſo ſo hideous maye bee ſhrowde themſelues vnder cloake naturall infirmitie ſaying manne bee equall god thinke haue doone verie muche yeelding ſuche confeſsion haue ſhewed alreadie behooueth v haue theſe two point one muſt acknowledge god rightuous reſpect whole worlde men muſte pleade diſpute wyth whoſoeuer ſo euer able alledge muſt bee abaſhed great ſmall lo one ſpeciall poynt ech man ſhould haue eye particularly himſelfe euery man ſhould ſorie fault abhorre condemne heerevpon ſhould alſo conſider vengeance puniſhmentes whiche god ſendeth vpon ſinnes ende ſhould learne fare better thereby beaten roddes let euerie v ſaye good right haue well deſerued god teach v men coſte ſo hee chaſtizeth men eye let ſame touch v let v applie ſuch example owne inſtruction intent preuent matter god bee compelled fall vpon v bycauſe wee haue profyted chaſtizementes hee hath ſhewed v perſon others thus yee ſee two poyntes wee haue marke put vre let v come laying forth ſayd iob know truth ſaith man ſhall iuſtifyed god ſet downe word importeth much godward doctrin great weight man know wel vvhat cauſe men iuſtifye themſelues ſo boldly ſay preſume ſo muche themſelues ſet ſo much ſtore themſelues bee ſo full pryde vvhat elſe cauſe ſtaying belowe euery man compareth himſelfe neyghbour yee ſee wherevnto runne yee ſee alſo saint paule ſendeth v great iudge ſaying euerie man ſhall beare owne burthen ſayde friendes men beguile themſelues make ſuche compariſons theſe vvhat ſee men liue better ſelfe haue faultes ſo haue men ye ſee cauſe men condemne themſelues ought doe rather ſooth themſelues iuſtifying owne cace heere expreſſely ſayde man ſhall iuſtifyed god vvhat muſt wee doe ofte man ſpeaketh v ſinnes laieth afore v let v learne know muſt hold oure eye belowe looke vp iudgement ſeat lord ieſus chriſt haue accounte make muſte knowe incomprehenſible maieſtie god therefore lette euerie man thinke thereof ſhall v bee wakened withdrawe oure ſelues folly wee ſhall haue moe theſe vaine imaginacions dotage haue bin wont rocke ſinners aſleepe bin obſerued ſhoulde bee none debate nowe adayes chriſtendome aboute rightuouſneſſe fayth papiſtes perſuaded ſay namely wee become rightuous throughe meere fauoure god oure lorde ieſus chriſte ſhall become merites ſay good workes wherein ſaluation menne conſiſteth papiſtes ſtande ſo vpon merites ſo beſotted bycauſe looke vp god diſpute theyr ſchooles whether good workes deſerue recompence wage well euill workes deſerue puniſhment thing flat contrarie men ſinnes deſerue puniſhed muſt alſo ſome rewarde vertues otherwiſe god iuſtice ſhoulde bee indifferent yea ſeeming ſo might men diſpute vpon ſhadowe yee ſee papiſtes fall aſleepe vpon diſputation yet meane whyle god ceaſſeth behalfe play iudge iudging according lawes behauing himſelfe according owne maieſtie witte finding thing men wee perceyue vertues godly deede ſaye ſuche might goe payment god ſomewhat ſhall haue priſed vttermoſt ſhall ſmoke come god muſt layde downe let v remember well ſayde heere man ſhall found rightuous god warde intente wee may take warning heereby ofte man ſpeakes v ſinnes muſt reſt bylowe rather euery one v muſt ſummon himſelfe god wee may knowe maner iudge hee ſo ſoone take vpon v pleade againſt muſt needes confounded ouerwhelmed iob addeth immediatly man would diſpute god hee ſhould anſwere one point thouſande true may well bee verefyed god wee may pleade faire tell long tale whereas ther ſhall thouſand pointes god voutſafe open lip reply vnto verie true coloure ſhall pretend iuſtifie ſelues may wel beare ſome countenaunce afore men bycauſe ſee ſo cleerely requiſite come vnto god vaniſheth away nothing let v thinke god amazed oure long great babbling ſhal haue caſt skum whē ſhal come point excuſing ſelues giue credit vertues peraduenture ſeeme god oughte yeelde vnto v yea meane whyle doth nothing laughe mocke vayne bragges menne alledge nothing worth thus yee ſee good holie ſentence whiche wee alledge thouſand article god wil anſwere ſo much one vvhat reaſon bycauſe nother heere ſighte may well made account men god bee moued awhit neuertheleſſe naturall meaof place come vnto god wit way incountering againſt ſhall ſo cō bred ſhal able anſwer one article thouſand ſhal alledge againſt v surely wee ſo haſtie needes fight god draw ſword ſay ſee ſo pray wil ſtreine curteſie aduenture vpō mortall man vpon creature nothing vpon liuing god wee intend make defiance
