man forecaſt thus able make parte good howe may compaſſe intent may turne v trouble diſpleaſure vvhen wee ſhall enter dealing againſt men wee make many diſcourſes wee bee mynded ruſh againſt god wee ſtep bluntly vvee ſee heereby rage yea euen diueliſhe rage men matche themſelues ſo againſt god come puſh ſhall fynd experience iuſtle againſte dalying ſuch prince thus yee ſee iob ſheweth firſt hee ſetteth downe mennes boldneſſe may perceyued afterward contrarie part ſetteth downe comberance wherin god maketh feele rightuous confoundeth lette v marke well men deſyrous pleade diſpute god wee ſee yet notwithſtanding entred chalendge muſt need ouerthrown god make feele muſt bee confounded ſpyte teethe verie needefull thing haue ſhewed alreadie fooliſhe ouerweening wherewith men deceyue themſelues proceedeth namely regard god make diſcourſes thus yea verelye woorſe men beſides haue vice haue vertues alſo recompence withall cauſe men ſo ouerſleepe themſelues knowe god maieſtie haue liuely feeling ſubmit themſelues therevnto sith caſe ſtandeth ſo let v marke well ſaid men deſyrous ſtande pleading diſputing againſte god ſo blind ſee ſelues ſay behold▪ god able ouerwhelme v thuſt v downe bottomleſſe pit hell yet ſhall go ſet ourſelues againſt wee neuer thinke therefore maruell though ſo blynde howbeit let euerie man bethink himſelfe well ſhall finde reaſon man ſpeake v pleading againſt god nature ſelfe teacheth v wee ought abhorre ſay euen wickeddeſt v vve ſee theſe scoffer haue nother conſcience feare god yet notwythſtanding remayneth ſome kynd feeling ingrauen nature ſo bee abaſſhed aſhamed ſayde wilte thou pleade againſt god neuertheleſſe euen alſo ſeeme bee good diſcreete men ſometimes fall ſuche manner talke ſo man whiche playeth horſe broken looſe making proteſtation againſt god vve ſee euen prophet haue bene aſſayled ſuch temptation true haue reſiſted behoued kynde conceite hath ſomewhat combered ſo haue bene ſorie nowe ſee god iudgemente ſo ſtraunge owne reaſon hathe good caryed awaye seeing wee bee ſo inclyned pleade againſte god ſo much better ought doctrine printed remembrance wee may bee reſtreined ſuche time wee bee tempted wiſe reaſon againſte god aſſuring oure ſelues wee gayne nothing ought warned heereof wee ſhall bee ſo greatly offended though wee ſee many leape ſort boundes ſtumblingblocke troubleth weake vvee would faine euery man confeſſed god bee rightuous mercie filleth whole world ought glorifie ſame hapneth wicked men rayle god ſome blaſpheme men dare open mouthe reproue rebuke ſo much haue full ſcope triumph worldward ſeene weake greeued ſeemeth mightie power rightuouſneſſe god defaced therby ſo yeld glory belongeth ſee naturall thing man pleade maner againſt god although monſtrous thing ſuch one ought abhor exceedingly yet ordinarie vice sith caſe ſtandeth ſo let v bee ouer muche diſquieted hapneth thus yee ſee wee haue beare mind behoueth v marke well added ſecond poynt wit god charge v thouſande article able ſcarſly anſwere one admoniſhed haue ſerched oure vice vttermoſte wee ſhall come knowledge hundreth parte ſo much one euerie thouſand true men examine themſelues well without hypocriſie muſte needes finde themſelues wrapped ſo many euilles may bee aſhamed themſelues vtterly diſmayed ſpecially wee thoughe man picke bee holyeſt yet muſte raunge ſelues one ranke dauid hathe confeſſed man attayne true knowledge ſinnes nowe holieſt ſuche ſeeme angells altogither confounded ſinnes bycauſe number infinite pray bee ſayde common ſort wee muſt neuer take ſelues haue profited ſo much wee ſtill farre behynde ſpeake men examine liues throughly ſhall find ſuch bottomleſſe gulf ſinnes ſhall vtterly diſmayed attayne yet knowledge hundreth part ſuch ſort requiſite ſo ye ſee dauid entred fault cryed knoweth owne ſinnes hee confeſſeth knew exceeding much afterward addeth lord clenze ſecrete ſinnes ſayeth ſo calleth ſecret ſinnes behoueth v knowe ſinnes elſe confeſſe ſinnes anſwer dauid wiſt wel god ſeeth cleerely wee doe ſo ſeeing conſcience vpbraydeth v ſhall ſay iudgement god ye ſee order haue kepe wit euery v enter himſelfe ſearch owne vice throughly ſo farre hee come knowledge haue ſifted thē well behold conſcience iudge maner iudge true iudge greatly bee feared dothe god ſee farre cleerer mortall man conſcience accuſeth mee thouſand ſinnes god enter reckening mee ſhall hee find many mo ſtandeth v hand wey well ſayde heere witte thouſand poyntes hard ſcarſly anſwere vnto one wee ſhall haue eſpyed one faulte ſelues god paſſeth farre ſeeth ſins priuie nowe folowing ſayd let v lerne bethink v fault ſuch wiſe wee may fully reſolued ſelues god contenteth himſelf commeth owne knowledge iudge according himſelfe ſeeth knoweth according finde leape ouer quicke cole ſayde prouerbe god plungeth v ouer head eares whome belongeth ſearch heart scripture attributeth vntoo beſides wee diſcerne ſo well betweene vice vertues ought doe poynt therefore muſt reſerued vnto wherefore deſcerne iudge well rightly work ſtandeth v hand know perfection without perfectneſſe nothing good god ſay filthyneſſe wher want perfection deſerueth allowed god perfection ſhewe itſelfe nowe howe ſhall know perfection conſidering eyſight ſo dim ſee twylight although god inlighten v yet haue wee ſo pure cleane ſight vſe brightneſſe hee ſheweth v true worde god entreth intoo bottome oure heartes perceth bone marie true burning creſſet true ieſus chriſt called dayſunne ſhineth ouer al yet eyſight ceaſſeth dim ſtil therefore ſtandeth v greatly hande knowe perfection hereby put mynde ſoeuer take thing bee good perceyue fault yet therefore without faulte knowe perfection god requireth ſhorte none god knoweth perfection ſoundneſſe hee knoweth feeble atteyne vnto cauſe ſayde wee may well ſet fayre face vpon matter ſhall able anſwer one poore poynte thouſand ſhall bee alledged layde afore v haue tolde already men warned pleade god ſhall alwayes find themſelues confounded damnation howbeit late warning profitable v reaſon intent blowe come euery man ſhoulde holde himſelfe within boundes ſoberneſſe modeſtie ſay ala thing v go law god thinke get vpper hande nay cleane contrariwiſe god ſhall ouerwhelme v behold way acquit hand euery man cō demne himſelfe fall ſturdineſſe god wil puniſh v ſuch pride may firſt puſh hee wil ſhew v confuſion length ſhal ſo ſnarled wee ſhall winde ſelues agayne yee ſee intoo maze god caſteth preſumptuous ſort vndertake ſtand againſt enterpriſe combate ſpoken heere true god ſo gracious ſome hee daunteth length fall aray muſte bee taken holde ſay worketh continually one faſhion vve ſhall ſee ſome full pride whiche truſt owne rightuouſneſſe would bind god vnto well god ouermaſtreth tameth caſteth vtter confuſion afterwarde plucketh againe vvee ſee god worketh alwaies one rate neuertheleſſe behoueth v alwayes vnderſtande ſcripture telleth v namely god ſtretch hand againſt proude deſtroy beholde proceedeth therin ſay hypocrits ſo puffed vp pride preſumptuouſneſſe thynke verely vertues deſerue receyued yea haue reward recompence vvell ſtande owne conceite tyme god letteth alone ſide satan eggeth inticeth maketh ſet much themſelues gaze owne gay fethers like peacock ſaying haue done beare themſelues hand god ought hold himſelf cōtented anone haue taken pleaſure themſelues vertues god cal acount proue face eſteemed vertue nothing vice yea ſtarke filthineſſe abhominacion comb cut good right ſhould ſo inſomuch whē haue beguiled worlde alſo themſelues truſting thing haue gay ſhew coū tenance outwardly thing muſt alwayes manifeſted whiche ſpoken sainct luke namely thyng excellent highly eſteemed among men abhominable god let v beware wee preſume ſo farre fight againſt god go law iuſtifie ourſelues elſe oure god confound v ſo ruſh againſt v ſhall oppreſſed ouerwhelmed thouſand crime wee ſhall able anſwer one bee accuſed thouſand deadly ſinnes ſaye infinite number intend cleere ſelues ſome one point ſhall caſt owne turne ſay let v beware come point end may touched better ſayde god wiſe hart mightie ſtrength poynt doctrine hath bin touched already heeretofore neuertheleſſe nought ſpoken heere new againe leſſon ought mind day day haue told already men beguile themſelues wanze away fond imaginatiōs bycauſe thinke vpon god reſt vpon themſelues beholde heere one inconuenience let v men thought vpon god ſhuld touched liuely acknowledge according declareth himſelfe vnto ſhould moued ſuche feare reuerence would glorify worthy reaſon bycauſe conceiue god ſuch one vvell skill ſay god god word runnes roundly vpō tung end yet meane infinite maieſtie perceiued awhit al god reſpect dead thing deede wel ſeene mennes blaſphemies periuries ſuche like thing men feeling god maieſtie ſhould heare ſo holy ſacred thing ſo rent torne peeces men ſo chafe god muſt faine abie iacke like maſter angrie fumiſh haſty man giue ſeruant buffet fiſt ſo teſty man wife elſe hys horſe diſpleaſe euen ſo play god ſee mē caſt vp choler god vnderling may well ſayd totoo dulheaded yea come point without chafed ſee theſe dogges make bone tearing name god although bee cauſe prouoke therevnto yet ceaſſe ſweare blaſphemouſly euery word mōſtrous thing againſt nature therefore good token knowe maieſtie god though word flye neuer ſo roundly mouth alſo ſtore ſorſwearings horrible cace dayes man cannot wring one worde truth let neuer ſo much ſolemnitie vſed bring thoſe called witneſſe yet ſeene bee ſworne inſomuch whole number ſuch depoſed man ſhall hardly finde one among halfe ſcore ſay truth indeede common byword among cace go wholly thē witneſſes much ſaye one wil ſpeake truth thus ye ſee ſpite god alſo pray talke men hold communication miniſtred holye ſcriptur whole religiō ſo holy thing wee haue day meete men ſhoulde hold thēſelues awe ſuch caces according ſayd true marke god child tremble hys word ſee men boldly reaſon god diſcourſing prating ſecrets maieſtie euen ſport theſe ſubſtantiall proof wee know god though name ryfe euery mannes mouthe▪ let v marke well thing whiche added heere namelye god wyſe hart myghtie ſtrength needeth true theſe woordes ſeeme ſo pithily ſpoken might haue bin well weyed found ſufficient force make v ſhrinke horne ſayd god wiſe hart meant worldly wiſdome ſuch wiſdome wit able comprehend ſayd ſtrong ſtrong hee gyant mountayne muſt glorifie ſuch wiſe muſt aſſure oure ſelues might ſtrength power like creature ſee nothyng ſee heere beneath wee muſt ſeeke ſtrength power god alone lo ſpeech importeth verely thing cannot bee ſo well gone preſent ought bee yet requiſite ſhould touch end might ſee manner iobs proceding rather holye ghoſts proceding ſpeaketh iobs mouth ſhewe v maner rightuouſneſſe god vvill vnderſtand well muſt take generall concluſiō whē ſhall open crymes bee found v ſo liue loocely walke honeſtly vnblamably worldward nothing vvhy ſo▪ ſort ſoeuer creature god condemne continue rightuous himſelfe wee attempt reply againſt true oure opinion may wel find ſay time god wil winke withſtand firſt brunt end muſt fayne ſtoupe receyue ſentence damnation men ſhall haue clapped hand v yea quit v cleere ſhall faile condemned confounded ſhall come great iudge hee ſees cleerely ſharply al men world ſo let v aſſure ourſelues none meane obteyne fauour god haue ſinnes couered euen haue frankly confeſſed nothing filth infection v fleeing refuge lord ieſus chriſt ſhal full perfect ryghtuouſneſſe bee found vertue whereof ſhall acceptable god finde hym mercifull v let v caſt ourſelues face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying wipe thē ſuch wiſe may come looking face yea howbeit preſuming aught ourſelues vpon gracious fauour hath ſhewed v lorde ieſus chriſte wherof hath bin make v partaker moreouer wil clenze v frō day day ſo purge v corruptiōs fleſh maye bee rightly ſanctified apeare blameleſſe latter day ſo let v ſay almightie god c xxxiiij sermon ſeconde vpon ninth chapter sermon conteyneth rest expoſition fourth fifth ſixth verſes foloweth 7 hee commaundeth sunne hee ſhyne starres ſhut vp hym vvith seale 8 ſpreadeth heauens vvalketh aloft vpon sea 9 made ſtarres arcturus orion pleiades chamber midday 10 hee doeth maruelous incomprehenſible vvorks vvonderfull thinges vvithout ende 11 behold goeth mee ſee hee paſſeth fro perceyue not▪ 12 hee catch ſnatch vvho hee ſhall plucke handes vvho hee vvill ſay vnto vvhat dooſt thou 13 god vvill vvithdravve vvrath mightieſt helpes ſhall ſtoupe vnto 14 vvhat enter talk make choyce vvordes vvith 15 although vvere rightuouſe yet could anſvver ſhould humble ſelf iudge wee wit knowe god accordingly hee vttereth himſelfe ſhould neede long proceſſe bee vſed euery v ſhould bee able diſcerne thynges ſet afore eye foraſmuchas ſo vntowarde behalfe god neede vpbrayde v vnthankfulneſſe telling v work purpoſe maketh ſayd heere namely god liſteth skie ſhall bee couered great thicke cloudes ſo sun ſhall ſeene contrarywiſe pleaſeth ſend lyght cope sky appereth faire pauiliō whych heauē maieſtie ſheweth itſelfe walketh aloft vpon sea ſay power ſheweth itſelfe throughly alſo ſetteth ſtars skye order according certaine number thys ſay reherſed v ende ſhoulde knowe duetie better apply mynds cōſidering god work wee may honour hee deſerueth although god hauing caſt v teeth vice v might leaue v ſuch yet notwithſtanding intent inſtruct v welfare two poyntes wee haue marke ſtreyne owne profit theſe firſt ſhould vnderſtand v thinketh vpon god wiſdome power ſuche ſort ought deede confeſſe ynough mouth ſame entreth hart thing wee ſhew contemptuouſneſſe touched yeſterday thorowly perſwaded wiſedome man vanitie ſtrength wee ſee creature nothing god ſhould hold v ſuch awe ſhould ye woulde ſay reyned vp hard ſhort brydle none v ſhould ſo hardie thinke ſpeake thing according god good pleaſure seing ſo negligent euery v beareth himſelfe giue bridle wicked thought nouriſh without remorſe conſcience inſomuch burſt euen outwarde deedes thereby ſhewe wee neuer knewe goddes maieſtie aright rather neuer taſted aught purpoſe elſe taſt thereof ſo vnſauery dyed hand heare ſayd god wiſdome mightineſſe knowen ſpoken ſort vnto v bycauſe wee ſo vntoward applying mynds moſt profit good ſooth greate ſhame v wheras liue world goodly large liſts god giueth v ſight al creature ſame croſſeth afore eye yet wee forget founder euen whoſe heauen earth ſhould mirrours glory according ſaid viſible thing wee maye ſee thing inuiſible ſeeing hath put v world wee make none account al geere muſt needes ſayd haue naughty mind verely wee bee ſtarke blind whenſoeuer god delt withal conceyue nothing except hee gyue v muſt fayne inlighten v elſe ſhall bee nothing darkneſſe wit howſoeuer cace ſtande cannot excuſe ſelues ignorance ſhall haue bene wilfulneſſe ioyned wee ſhal conuicted haue regarded god yea hath greeued v thinke bene ſome matter heauineſſe yee ſee firſt oure lord accuſeth v ſtreyne howbeit inſtruction ioyned wherein perceyue ineſtimable goodneſſe might condemne v leaue v haue ſayd alreadye true hee condemneth v howbeeit make v feele ſinne may corrected v herevpon dooth office good ſchoolemaiſter end ſhould lerne thing wee knewe therefore lette v take good heede ſhall ſhewed v heere cōfeſſe text ſpeaketh thing whiche euery v knoweth thynges ſeeme bee common familiar v therefore bee ſayd ſuperfluous talke ſaye peraduenture ſurmyze ſo forſomuchas referre thynges right marke muſt god ſayne playe ſchoolemaiſter repeating leſſon v oftentymes ought wee ſeeke owne profit god dooth ſo lay afore v verye darke matter god maketh ſunne ſhyne pleaſeth therewithall whole cope heauen ſhould appeare like greate pauilion intent wee might knowe oddes betwixte maieſtie god pompe earthly prince vvhen earthly prince indeuer aduaunce themſelues doo policy councelles much doo haue ſet vp one pauilion thirtie foote hyghe yea though two mile long yet compariſon yee ſee skye endleſſe god hathe ſtreyned ſame earth footeſtoole therefore ſee ſuch thing although knowledge ſo yet nothyng woorth go conſideretion always muſt come backe poynt namely ſee heauen muſt better bethinke v god maieſtie incomprehenſible ſo may moued honour ſubmit ourſelues vnto hym ought doe nowe perceyue ſuperfluous matter ſayde heere lorde commaundeth ſunne ſhall ſhyne ſunne ſhall hidden cloudes ſuch wiſe may ſeeme god draweth curtayne afore afterwarde hee vnfoldeth heauen hee liſteth muche meant hee ſayeth hee walketh vpon water sea surely wee ſee walke vpon poſsible ſea continue ſuch ſtate dooth reſtreyned woonderfull power wee knowe nature water ſheade abrode yet ſee sea ſwelleth vp likeneſſe mountaynes beſette wyth bound ſhall ſee eyghtandtwentith chapter ſo much earth ſhould needes couered ouer hande vvhereas wee haue drye ground dwell vpon let v thinke happeneth cauſe goddes lodge v heere time holdeth ſea within barres bound ſtone timber owne power although ſea haue ſo great violence may ſeeme nothing able hold backe yet notwithſtanding god holdeth backe ſtill euen vntoo day woorde hee ſpake ſhould ſome drye ground men harber ought wee bend wit way wee therefore let v marke ſuperfluous needleſſe doctrine ſayde god walketh ſo vppon sea afterwarde mention made ſtarres true number infinite according ſayde another pſalme witte ſo great number ſtarres would requyre long diſcourſe vnder theſe fewe name heere iob meant put v mind whole beautifull hoſte heauen beſydes planet ſee ſtarres firmament ſee ſerue marke ſomething wee myght better conſider woonderfull woorkmanſhip mouing skyes vve ſee well sunne keepeth one circuit euery day hee riſen goeth downe againe turneth earth well beneathe aboue men ſee alſo wee ſee sunne hath another cleane contrarie courſe whereof commeth winter whereof commeth sommer sunnes approching v retyring away v keeping hygher lower gate reſpect v according goeth v draweth neerer v thereafter maketh diuerſitie ſeaſons vve ſee ſay euen rudeſt moſt ignorant v true perceyue sunne walketh cleane contrary courſe maketh keeping dayly courſe experience thereof knowen effect wee haue nother winter ſommer sunne although wee knowe yet wee ſufficiently conceyue ſort god ordeyneth thys walke sunne ſide ſtarres iob nameth v heere informe v thing like ſee wheeles chariot turne bycauſe extree ouerthwart wherevpon twoo naues meanes whereof wheeles go euen ſo god hath ſet theſe twoo starres bee naues wheele charyot sunne ſeene turne vve ſee knowledge theſe thing god ineſtimable wiſdome may better perceyued leaſtwiſe men ſhall haue ſome taſt whereby ſhall prouoked magnifie ſaying lord excellent thy woorkmanſhp verely thing iob toucheth cannot bee fully vnderſtoode except man haue ben conuerſant learning toucheth aſtrologie hee contented ſpeake whiche rudeſt ideots doe ſee hee paſſeth toucheth cunningly certayne particular intent ſhoulde▪ knowe workmanſhip skyes howbeit althoughe men aſtronomers yet man excuſe himſelfe god giueth ſufficiente knowledge thoſe thing wee ſhet eye sunne ſhyneth ſhepherdes countrie well skill ſpeake starres yea giue name howbeeit namyng certain darken glorie god wherof commeth muſt euill imputed men twoo starres named heere poet haue feyned many fable fond thing vvherof commeth ſuch vnreaſonableneſſe vayneſſe naughtineſſe men haue ſaid ſuch starre crounet garlond woman elſe woman hirſelfe lo heere cow lo ox lo heere lo ſhort lo ſort dotage neuertheleſſe wee haue marke theſe dotage ſprung satan ſuttleſt wylineſſe deſyre ſo farre poſſible deface fayre lookingglaſſe wherein god bee ſene knowen ſayd moyſes god garniſhed heauen hoſtes thereof moyſes termeth starres well planet reſidue hoſte heauen ſo furniture heauen skyes ſhould without beautie faſhiō garniſhed ſtarres performed creation worlde moyſes declareth ſee howe diuell beguyleth men make forget record god hath gyuen workes make beleeue starres come place yea men haue intermingled villanies filthineſſe ther nothing elſe whoredomes idolls ſpake starres heauen lyke pope canonizeth ſaincts whome liſteth idolater canonized lemans idolls woulde fayne haue heauen infected wyth filthineſſe well earth yee ſee satan hath ſent illuſions worlde aboliſhe knowledge god poſsible darken ſuche wiſe men might wander theyr owne follyes haue feeling pure truth requiſite vvhat bee done lette v marke well iobs intent heere teache v bee aſtronomers ſo farre capacitie beare may referre glorifying god ſo goodly order heauen ſee touching firſt point ſayde god intendeth make v aſtronomers yea ſo farre forth eche man capacitie wil beare decypher particularly many starres therewithall tell skylight men call planet witte diſtance highneſſe lowneſſe long large reſpects haue one another good ſooth cannot comprehend geere wee ſee experience sunne hygher moone bycauſe moone commeth full betweene ſight sunne behold made eclipſe whereby ſaye perceyue moone lower may well perceyue ſuche thing yet notwithſtanding meane wee knowe ſpace reaſon howe commeth paſſe moone paſſeth ſo betweene sunne v therefore euery man cannot knowe howbeit wee haue ſome kynd conceyuings ought ynough humble v may conſider workes god meane lord would groſſer ſort meene thoſe haue meane follow learning ſhould haue ſufficient occaſion wiſe ynough glorifie ſayd moyſes two greate lyghts one rule day rule nyght moone bigger starres planet certayne starres skye bigger moone cannot wee ſee ſo great bycauſe farre diſtance v exceeding hygh reſpecte v inſomuch ſeeme ſo great bee reaſon greate diſtaunce betweene skyes v god ſpeaketh vnto v theſe thing according perceyuing according vvhy ſo ſhould ſay true men atteyne ſo ſharp vnderſtanding know big planet proportion starres bee diuided euery man ſay knowes open eye looke vp ye ſhall ſee sunne lanterne light yea greate light lighteneth whole world yee ſhall ſee ſhyning moone men ynough make glorifie infinit wiſdome god according alſo ſayde god hath cut excuſe intent ſhould raunge aduenture bycauſe bee greate clerk ſayeth open eye withoute hauing skill ye ſhall conſtreyned honour mee woonder wiſdome power goodneſſe alſo vſe towardes imploying ſuch creature ſeruice al matter lye referring theſe thing right ende wherein ſee fondneſſe mannes wit philoſophers diſplayed great treaſures god wiſdome reſpect aſtrologie thing ſurmounteth opinion man ſee could ſpye thing ſo hidden true ſuche ſhall reade aſtrologie may well comprehend knowe thing ſpoken thereof book woonderouſneſſe firſt write ſpeake ryght aſtrologie baſtard aſtrologie ſoothſayers ſorcerers vſe telling men good fortune ſuch like thing ſpeake learning ſcience whereby men knowe order sky goodly furniture men ſee certeſſe man ſhall ſee woonderfull thing ſo ſhall abaſhed heare aſtronomers ſpeake true imagin thing skyes imagin without reaſon doo ſhewe certaine degree meaſures thing myght hygh deepe comprehend vvell haue philoſophers diſputed much thys matter hathe god giuen greater grace bee beleeued note marke god ſecrets high yet haue miſſed principall poynt haue knowne god yee ſee bee wanzed away owne thoughtes euill haue profited whome god hath bin ſo gracious lift aboue skyes ſuch wiſe haue meaſured man might meaſure plat lande houſe ſaye ſo many pace ſo many foote lyke man myght meaſure ſome place heere bylowe ſo haue philoſophers meaſured ſpaces betweene planet alſo starres themſelues ſhort thing hath alwayes bin atteyned vnto yet meane whyle haue knowne god ſheweth himſelfe openly hys creature little hath knowledge led glorifying haue rather darkened maieſtie vvee ſee ſtandeth v hand take another way whereas ſpeaking sunne planet starres end ſhould knowe theſe naturall reaſons reſt ende wee ſhoulde bee guided vntoo god honoure doo homage wee behold glory hee ſheweth vttereth vnto v viſible creature thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreine vvee ſee adayes men wit wander become fond time heeretofore thing ſhewed v heere although ſpeake starres yet neede go farre perceyue god let v abyde ſtill ourſelues saint paule ſayeth ſeuententh act let v looke euery man himſelfe ſhall find haue mouing power v god dwelling v yet comprehend wee ſay haue eye wee neede grope ſayeth ſainct paule hee vſeth ſame word blind man goeth groping darke though grope eye ſhut yet god ſpight teethe make v feele power wiſdome goodneſſe rightuouſneſſe continue blockiſh beaſtly vtterly witleſſe true ſharpwitted ynough vayne tryfling thinges cace ſaluation wee fayle wee bee woorſe brute beaſtes haue one drop good wit much therefore behoueth v marke well theſe ſentences wherin lord ſheweth v looke vp heauenward ought bethink v thus behold god hath giuen v eye perceyue thys goodly order looke downward ought thinke ſheweth itſelf euery lette v aſſure ourſelues god whiche ſheweth himſelf opēly intent ſhould think vppon thus yee ſee wee may profit ſelues text bee ſhort let v bee well aduiſed occupie ſelues ſtudie vntill wee haue comprehended power wiſdome god wee maye put mynd honoure ſay honoure hee worthy men acquit themſelues lightly haue doone ſome ceremonie vnto god think ought hold himſelf contented honour requireth due vnto ſhould quake vnder oft heare hym ſpoken ſhould acknowledge hym bee indge abaſhed aſſuring ourſelues able ſinke v one onely loke able make mountaynes melt away wax doeth againſt sunne ſhall become v ſo frayle firſt let v abaſhed maieſtie god afterward let v alſo take hold hir ryghtuouſneſſe behoueth ſaying nothing hath hee fountayne benefit wee feele ſort god fearing earneſtly trembling maieſtie profit muſt make howbeeit foraſmuchas wee bee yet farre point let euery one v learne record leſſon thus yee ſee haue beare mynd concerning texte furthermore requiſite go ſeeke ſtories whither mountaynes haue bene ſunken deepe when▪ ſayde heere god remoueth mountaynes feele ſerueth ſhewe like hee hathe ſettled earth builded vpon deepe foundacions pleaſe chaunge ſuch wiſe mountaynes ſhall turned intoo valleyes iob recyteth thing already come paſſe ſome certayne tyme place ſheweth thing god doo according ſayde another text pleaſeth mountaynes melt away waxe doeth heate sunne ſo ſerueth v vnderſtande doo ſo often hee liſteth yee ſee haue marke cheefly doone muſt compare owne fraylneſſe wee compariſon mountayne howe greate firmneſſe artillerie world doo nothing v needeth one little finger ouerthrowe v nowe god looke bee ſo terrible dreadfull heauen earth ſhake ſcripture ſayeth ſhall mortall man bee able ſtande vvhen wee ſhall haue knowne oure owne frailtie throughly digeſted god myghtie power ſhall haue doone verye much howbeit foraſmuchas thinke ſeeldome let v hardely learne lyfe long let v ſtudy leſſon let v alwayes bee ſcholers iob hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth god paſſeth ſeeth hee goeth fro hee perceyueth wherein doeth v witte although god vtter himſelfe vnto v yet ſhall inuiſible god vttereth ſheweth himſelf vnto v work ſubſtance ſubſtance ſhall neuer ſee neuertheleſſe wee knowe ſuche ſorte conſtreyned ſee hand hathe paſſed way thus ye ſee recorde yeeldeth v preſence god paſſeth v ſay maketh v perceiue power ſpreddeth itſelfe ſuch wiſe whole worlde hard hand v yet notwithſtanding hee inuiſible ſay although ſayde vttering ſhewing himſelfe according nature yet haue full knowledge thereof nother aree able comprehende reaſon ſmall capacitie wit wee ſtand aſtonyed example ſee ground bring foorthe frute behold put mynde goodneſſe power god ſpringtime wee ſee earth open hir bowel vtter hir rich behold god ſheweth himſelfe paſſeth v agayne one whyle ſunne ſhyneth another rayneth doeth god paſſe eyther ſide v maketh walke fro according varietie hee ſheweth much went one place another intent men ſhould vew better hee ſettled ſome one place abide chayre without remouing ſhould perceyue ſo well hee walketh vp downe verely intent gathet v better hymſelfe vvel god ſhewed vnto v ſo wit wee conceiue ſayd power vertue ſheweth itſelfe tree corne herbes vynes thing may well haue ſome vnderſtanding wee may well perceyue ſome thing howbeeit part god ſhall neuertheleſſe paſſe fro yet ſhall ſee theſe thing ſo bace ſeeme greate value god walke v perceyue little ſhall wee wee come higher woorks ſecret god intendeth worke extraordinarie maner like ſometymes executeth iuſtice yea euē ſuch wiſe aſtonied cannot perceyue commeth paſſe bee aſtonied thing god ſheweth dayly may comprehended order nature muſt need fayle vtterly witts ende ſhall come thoſe woorks farre greater certaine needes muſt therefore let v marke well ſayd god paſſeth v ſhall perceyue heereby warned ſtand contention god ſay ſhall bee doone ſhall come paſſe hys power infinite yea although ſhewe itſelfe euen ſmalleſt thing yet bee comprehended reaſon although yet perceyue part haue told alreadye muſt expounded ſubſtaunce god onely hys woorke whereby vttereth himſelfe vntoo v yet ſheweth himſelfe come neere v ſo familiarly ſee ſhall wee doo compariſon purpoſe come vnto himſelf enter talke ſurmount him▪ shall wee bee mightie ynough wee ſee ouerweening men mind match themſelues ſo god weene thēſelues able ſtie aboue cloud ala ſee folly rather madneſſe let v marke well purpoſe ſentence placed haue layd foorth iob treateth god power ſtrength ſaying god catcheth plucke fist hee dare ſay vntoo doest thou ſo verely ſeemeth iob graunteth heere abſolute power god ſuch one hath nother right reaſon let v marke hee purſueth ſtill ſame poynt declared yeſterday witte god iuſtice conſiſteth onely puniſhing tranſgreſſors crymes notorious vvherin euen god woorketh ſo ſtraungely hee ſeemeth vntoo v haue reaſon dooings doo v wrong ſo euen vnbeleeuers take occaſion grudge againſte hym euen therein ſpecially wee muſt acknowledge ryghtuouſneſſe ſtreyne ſayde god ſnatch doeth hee ſnatch hereby meante god vſe anye terrible power maketh v afrayde lion oftentimes hee likeneth himſelfe wild beaſts ſuch wiſe ouerwhelmeth turneth earth vpſide downe ſay god thundereth ſuch ſort ſo amazed yet may man ſay vnto wherefore doeſt thou ſo much leſſe may hee plucke play fiſt ſay men pleade god ſhall loſe time true men thinke haue good cauſe make complaint yea ſo ſenſeleſſe behalfe haue ſpewed vp blaſphemies thinke haue gotten victorie god end muſt condemned whenſoeuer god liſteth reply againſt make feele power might tyrannouſe power haue imagined yet infinite power ſheweth itſelfe vnderſtanding ſaye whither god rightuous according perceiue god rightuous euen would condemne accordingly one ſiftith pſalme thou ſhalte bee found ryghtuouſe euen thou haſte condemned men may men well ſtriue againſte god yet ende mouthes ſhall bee ſtopped god ſhall founde ryghtuouſe doeth prophet dauid vſe manner ſpeeche bycauſe men ſo preſumptuouſe make god ſtoupe lure make bone condemning iuſtifie themſelues ye ſee maner ſentence iobs muſt expounded wee ſee effect hee hath confirmed matter delt yeſterday wit concerning power ſtrength god deſyrous knowe power ſtrength god let v ſettle wit conſideration order nature ſee heauen earth ſame may ſerue bring v vnto god yea may ſo conceyue may humble ſelues yeeld honour thys ynough v yet let v go surely ouergreate brutiſhneſſe v heauen earth whole order nature ſuffizeth v ſhewe v god ye ſee booke written letter big ynough withall ſo great ſtore diuers inſtructions ſhall haue profited thouſand ſhall hundred thouſand others wherat ought learne ſomewhat wee ſo dull nother heauen earth profit v let v come ſelues let v bethinke v well doth god come ſo familiarly vnto v well work thing ſee ſelues though cannot knowe yet leaſtwiſe let v perceyue whē worketh ſo familiarly v certayne fayle behalf therfore muſt conclude wee haue wit knowe god ſhall haue inquired god preſence power let v lerne humble ourſelues according iob addeth heere concluſion behold ſayeth whenſoeuer ſhall come anſwer neuer attempt iustifie ſelfe wil ſubmit myſelfe iudge intreate ſee wherevnto leaneth iob hath ſpoken although talke diſordered verely may gather good leſſon though haue generalitie hath bin declared heeretofore iob ſheweth v mark ſhooteth certayne wil profit v double let v marke well word iob hath ſpoken god power wiſdome giuen ſome mirrours preſidents ſayeth done frēds ye ſe god iudge vvhen euery v hath looked himſelf put cace euill doer haue led altogither wicked life put cace wee haue bin whoremonger murtherers theeues put cace god bee able charge v haue liued naughtily wantonly yet notwithſtanding dare ſo bold opē mouth ſay rightuouſe deſerue well thou ſhouldeſt receyue mercie dare preſume ſo bold▪ bee doone vve muſt come iudge intreate fayre meanes worde intrcate importeth muſt pleade gilty ſay wee muſt knowe nothing matter death damnation v nothing ſin wickedneſſe v haue none refuge mere mercie thus ye ſee word intreate importeth ſo oft ſpeaking preſenting ſelues god maieſtie let v marke well cannot bee glorified hand ought bee except wee bee brought vtterly vnder foote ſo mouthes ſtopped whole world confeſſe themſelues indetted vntoo god paule ſpeaketh thirde romanes therfore come make intreatance iudge let mynd iuſtifie ſelues ſhall get good ſo alſo let v imagin honor god requireth v conſiſteth ceremony braueries like thing let v ſtand vpō apiſh toyes papiſts vpō wote gewgawes men haue broughte thēſelues ſay let v think god ſerued honored hand ſuch geere let v bend wit dedicate ſelues wholly vntoo hym framing ourſelues rule hee hath giuen v word aſſuring ourſelues ſo dayly increace graciouſe gift v vntill haue brought v ſaluation notwithſtanding vnworthy let v fal flat face good god aknowledgemēt innumerable fault cōmit dayly againſt beſeching make v know thē better haue done wee may bee touched true repentance deſire guide v way leading v holy ſpirit receiuing v hys childrē hath adopted perſon onely sonne wil make preciouſe bloud auaylable hath ſhed redemptiō end confounded ſinnes offence haue cōmitted againſt wee may flee mercie refuge mean may pleaſe ſuſteyn v infirmity ſuffer v giuē ouer worldly vanity may couet heauē ly thing apply al wit therevnto may c xxxv sermon thirde vpon ninth chapter sermon contayneth ſtill expoſition xiij xiiij xv verſes text ſet downe 16 call vpon anſvver mee yet vvould thinke hath heard mee 17 hath ſmitten mee dovvne vvith vvhirle vvind hath vvounded vvithout cauſe 18 giueth mee ley ſure take breathe filleth mee vvith bitterneſſe 19 man go ſtrength beholde hee ſtrong man deale vvith hym iuſtice vvho may cope vvith 20 iuſtifie ſelfe myne ovvne mouth condemneth mee alledge myne vprightneſſe ſhall eſteeme frovvard 21 ſay ſound yet knovv ſoule life miſliketh 22 behold one point vvherein reſolued vvit god deſtroyeth ryghtuous vnryghtuouſe alike yeſterday wee treated thys poynte namely although wee knowe ſinnes ſufficiently yet notwithſtanding behoueth v come vnto god intreatance ſay euery v muſt acknowledge himſelfe wretched ſinner aſſure ourſelues v haue neede mercie condemne v good right according paule ſayeth al v runne arrerages ſo bycauſe ſayeth deſtitute god glory menward may wel glorifie ourſelues maye ſeeme vntoo v wee haue good cauſe ſo doo come wee greate iudgementſeate muſt al v ſtand confounded ye ſee ſayd god withdrawe wrath ſtrong helpes ſhall bee beaten downe hym ſhall haue gathered togither may ayde v god ſhall ouerturne euery whit except pacified ſay except hee goodneſſe receyue v mercie hope wee ſhould preuayle agaynſt therfore behoueth v fall ſome agreement may god ſet one men making payement themſelues ſhewing themſelues rightuouſe hee maketh inquiſition making intreatance according haue ſayd already let v mark vayne ſeeke meanes heere withſtand god wrath ſtop wee ſhould conſumed behoueth v keepe way ſhewed v wit wrath god muſt pacified thus much concerning poynt nowe iob addeth loſte time make choice woordes god vvhereby doeth v wit mē may like well vſe retorik according many beſotte themſelues owne word like well opinion like bleare eye cleerſyghted ſo god ſhall bee beguyled alſo iob ſayeth heere ſhall haue chozen word told goodly painted tale might amaze hearer god paſſe whit muſt babling retorike ceaſſe wee come heauenly throne tung heard men thought muſt come light theſe bookes muſt bee opened god make none inquiſition bringing forth owne cōſciences may hide excuſe themſelues many ſtartingholes muſt 〈…〉 themſelues open ſo muſt knowen apparant let man beguile himſelfe alledge afore men geere muſte ouerthrowen god ſummoneth v hym heereby iob meeneth effect wee muſte meaſure god rightuouſneſſe rightuouſneſſe men wee pleade manner men doubte cace go ourſide yea wee ſuppoſe whole worlde ſhall haue quitte v iuſtified v yea clapped hand v wee ourſide ſhall haue liued ſuch ſorte fault may bee found v yet ſhall wee ſtop ſhort wee come vnto god chaunce ſhall bee quite chaunged lette v learne aduauntage wee haue worldwarde ſhall bee nothing vanitie ſo wee ſtande god muſt firſt marke well wee muſte call mynde mightie power whereof mention hathe bene made heeretofore ſhall bee bereft glorie according sainct paules ſaying ſteade imagining ſelues haue power cleere ſelues wee ſhall finde ſo much one ſilie drop goodneſſe v deſerueth bee made account vvhen men ſo condemned flee refuge mercie god poynte holy ghoſt intendeth bring v vnto foloweth ſhal haue called vpon hee haue anſwered mee yet ſhall thinke hee hath hearde voice hee hath hearkned beholde heere ſtraunge ſaying although god heare v outwarde apparance yet doth hee make v feele goodneſſe ſuch ſorte wee bee vtterly deſtitute help iob ſayeth hee ſhall haue obtayned requeſtes ſo god hath pitie anſwered yet hee looke bee condemned hande prayer haue profited nothing howe ſhall take doubt iob expreſſeth temptation men ſo long god ſheweth himſelfe againſt according wee haue ſeene followeth like phraze ſpeache heeretofore true iob reſted yet hee touched ſuche paſsion man findeth himſelfe ſame plight god commeth call make hym feele iuſtice ſuch ſorte vtterly diſmayde vve come ſo lowe firſt brunt true god come fight againſt v ſuche wiſe wee ſee like enimie aduerſarypartie againſt v certayne ſhall bee frighted ſuche feare nothing may aſſuage anguiſh wherewith wee ſhall bee ouertaken incombered although god haue anſwered v yet beleeue ſo rather thinke • e perſecuteth v whatſoeuer hope haue put v yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe increace ſtill ſtripes ye ſee diſcomforte bee whiche haue taken conceyte god againſt aſmuch preſent paſsion dreadfull haue good cauſe ſence ſelues aforehand wee may withſtand bee firſt formeſt lette v vnderſtande bee like caſe iob fewe thinke according owne ſenſualitie ſeemeth v none miſerie aduerſitie whiche wee feele body preſent lyfe ſo wee come theſe ſpirituall battels whereby god trieth v holding conſciences ſo locked vp wee wote ſay riſen vp agaynſt v hee thundereth downe vpon v hath ſet v ful afore white ſhoote although god examine v ſo neere quicke firſt yet muſt euery v haue eye therevntoo thinke wyth oure ſelues ala god ſende v onely ſome ſickneſſe ſmite v ſome maner reſpect bodie ſmall thing compariſon torment hee maketh folkes feele hee ſetteth nothing afore wrath vengeance maketh though would damne drowne vtterly seeing cace ſtandeth ſo let v pray god ſhall pleaſe hym bring v poynt hee giue v power ſtrength ſtande howe euen calling promiſes remembrance true god wrath conſuming fire truly ſo ſoone giueth v incling wee muſt needes bee vtterly diſmayde vndoubtedly men ſeeke ſtrength themſelues withſtand ſuch incounters muſt faine borrowe god hand according god diſmayeth v ſheweth v ſigne vengeance ſo contrarie part rayſeth v graues yea euen bottome hell finally lifteth v vp aboue cloudes ayre maketh v taſte goodneſſe euen meanes promiſes lo howe wee borrowe ſtrength god fight agaynſt temptation yet neuertheleſſe iob ſheweth v heere faythfulleſt pacienteſt thoſe god giueth ſpirit doth men ſhall exempted preſent temptation wit ſhall know become middes diſtreſſes god preſſeth vpon heare think ſtil ſhaken god minded pitie theſe temptation ſhould laſt ſtill certaine wee ſhould miſſe blaſpheme god vvhen faith quenched ſhould needes go aſtray ſhould bee harried away helliſh rage howbeit god woundeth faythfull ſort abateth ſmart ſtripes healeth ſhould bee ouerthrowne flung downe hell turning hande god gaue v ſome taſt goodneſſe ſuch diſtreſſes iob hild himſelf faſt cōcluſion god intended heare bene vndone beene remedie let v marke hee poſſeſſed oppreſſed ſuch deſpayre hee vttereth god made feele goodneſſe ſome ſort vve ſee yet much better perſon lord ieſus chriſt ſayth vvhy haſt thou forſakē deed extremitie partie beareth burthen al ſinnes world therefore requiſite ieſus chriſte ſhould feele himſelfe forſaken god father yet neuertheleſſe cōfort cōtrarie ſhewed ſaying god god long cā call vpon god aſſuring ſelues ſauiour may preace vnto ſo long doth faith beare ſway thereby wee bee perſwaded god hath forſaken v yet meane ceaſſe haue ouerheady paſsion wherein fleſh findeth ſelfe gulſe ſo hath light reſpect naturall vnderſtanding reſpect aught wee ſee inſomuche wee haue debated matter throughly wee conclude none otherwiſe god agaynſt v god enemie leaſt god hath ſet v plight pray gyuen vp vnto sathan ſo hope meane recouerie yee ſee plundge god putteth v howbeit reſpect fleſhly vnderſtanding according owne reaſon aught wee ſee nature god giueth v ſparke brightneſſe hee giueth v ſome feeling fayth howbeit wee neither know diſcerne yee ſee paule ſayeth ſighes gronings whiche god ſtirreth vp v make v pray vnto vnutterable ſay cānot expreſſed beholde faythfull man prayeth vnto god ſigheth groneth maner beholde ſayeth paule faithfull perſon maketh ſupplication vnto god knoweth doeth thing outreacheth mind al thought wee become like brute beaſtes praying vntoo god wee bee voyde vnderſtanding paule meeneth ſo intent ſay god worketh ſtraunge faſhion wee bee ſo ouercombered owne paſsions wee wote ſay ſee likelyhood bee fauorable mercifull v ſuch pecke trouble although inſight ſo dimme cannot perceyue god ſupplie infirmity yet neuertheleſſe let v tarie leyſure till woorke v yea euen ſome meane vnknowne v high v attaine vnto lo howe iob pretendeth hee beleeued god regarded heard although anſwered bee ſhort hee doeth v vnderſtand preſent temptation ſo vnruly exceſsiue forwent whole taſte god goodneſſe yea fayth good quenched reſpect owne naturall reaſon vtterly periſhed bicauſe little fire vnder aſhes good choked iob ouerwhelmed tēptation ala ſhall become v holy goſt hath ſet v mirrour pacience brought ſo lowe falne ſo deepe pit dreadfulneſſe pray god touch v quicke muſt needes ſwallowed vp whirlpoole muche neede haue pray god ſtrengthen v though light ſuch temptation let v bee hart token god hath caſt v away deſtitute holy ſpirite ſo vſeth wonderfull faſhion gouerning reſcuing thoſe notwithſtanding reſpect owne nature haue conceyts imagination diſmay plundge ouer head eares yea euen downe hell ſo remaineth nothing ſay diuell holdeth ſlaues haue eye ſo troubled time able loke dazeled neuerthelater leaueth ſome feeling maieſtie holde alwayes backe ſhould vtterly deſpayre thus ye ſee effect haue marke middes theſe great temptation diuell ſhall haue wonne ſo much hand ſhall ſeeme vnto v wee muſt vtterly ouerwhelmed ſhift get muſt continue calling vpon god yea euen til ſuch time haue giuen v light ouercouered v time quite quēched haue ſayd ſhould haue become v god ſhould haue left v vp altogither▪ god ſuffereth ſayd brightneſſe fayth holy ſpirit hath put v ſtifled ſame maner haue alreadie declared cōpariſon litle fire ouercouered aſhes cace fire may neuertheleſſe bee kindled againe time euen ſo faith ſmouldred ſuch ſort ſheweth one ſparke vntill god kindle v againe chace away darkneſſe wee poſſeſſed ouerwhelmed iob hath vttered ſentence addeth beholde hath ſmitten downe whirlwinde wounded without cauſe vvhen iob ſayeth god ſtrickē downe whirlwind ſignifie wōder though imagin god ſo ſore agaynſt cānot natural reaſon hope fauour hād ye thinke ſtraunge ſayth ſhould ſay cannot ſuppoſe god doth heare ſhal haue anſwered haue eye preſent affliction wherewith ſo wholly poſſeſſed nothing may aſſuage grief haue touched already namely woundes god maketh ſheweth himſelf enemie whē cyteth v iudgement ſee nothing angry coūtenance ſenſible therfore whē come poynt certaine bee ſo ouerwhelmed ſorrow nothing may cōfort v giue v pacientneſſe ſee iobs meening wit preſent time god wrath feeling therof bereft al mean cōforting himſelfe harkning declaration could made comfort withall muſt alwayes beare minde hath bin declared heretofore wit god neuer ſheweth himſelfe ſo angrie towardes owne maketh feele hys goodneſſe ſome wiſe howbeeit ſo alwayes perceiue thing eaſie comprehend ſhould ſo neuertheleſſe behoueth v wayt wil god child yet ſhall haue much ado perceiue practiſe poore mā aſſaulted theſe tēptations ſhall perchanc ſay doth god regard beholde pine away cal vpon yet find cōfort therfore ſigne hath ſhaken afterward ſinnes come remembrance diuel ſtirreth vp ſtore ſuch ſtuffe horrible thus ye ſee poore creature vtterly ouerwhelmed vvhen paſt cōmeth god make al whole conſcience ſo tormented afore becōmeth quiet loke nothing darkeneſſe doeth nowe ſhine ſheweth ſwete amiable coūtenance maner fayre weather wit though partie ſuch temptation time god ſuffer fayth periſh vtterly disfeated impoſsible fayth vncorruptible ſeede oure ſoules howbeeit haue ſayd alreadie reſpect man whole naturall wit reaſon muſt needes blind vntill god ſhew v fauor behoueth v marke wel theſe wordes iob ſayth god ſmyteth whirlewind intent vtter extraordinarie maner dealing though god layd vpon cudgell though giuen mee ſtripe ſwoorde hath afrighted ſayeth hee caſt downe ſome thunderbolte ſome whirlwinde vpon mee blowes wee receyue heere bylowe alwayes ſo deadly thunder light vpon v heauen wee bee deade men iob therfore meeneth wound hath receiued ſunken bottōleſſe deepes ſayeth lightning whirlwinde falne vpon frō heauen worth noting one satan policy driue v deſpayre bearing v hand god hādleth v vnaccuſtomed rigour satan tell v eare meeneſt thou true god chaſtizeth ſinners afterwarde pitieth god viſiteth owne loueth fatherly maner alwayes moderateth rigour thee doth hādle thee ſo thundreth agaynſt thee howe canſt thou perſwade thy ſelfe ſhewe thee mercie impoſsible diuell beares v hand god vſeth accuſtomed rigour agaynſt v maketh v conclude wee ſhall thenceforth haue recourſe vntoo muſt truſt euer receyue v fauour much behoueth v marke text wherein iob ſayth ſmitten whirlewinde nowe haue paſſed way yet wee ſee god ſuccour neuertheleſſe let v wayte like ſelues furthermore let v marke well iob ſpeaketh heere according affliction hee ſenſeleſſe god onely thundred vpon alſo gaue knowledge feele god thundered beene ynough haue ouerwhelmed meane ſeaſon hee ſecrete remedie haue ſayde therefore let v hope like concerning addeth god hath giuen many wound without cauſe ſeemeth rude geere god ſhould tormēt men ſort without cauſe onely ſimple vniuſtice ſuch crueltie bee taken iudge worlde rather tyrant ſeemeth iob blaſphemeth god ſaying hee ſmitten wounded withoute cauſe remember hath bene ſayd ſhall know meening hee ſpeaketh holy ghoſt hath guyded gouerned tung intent ſhoulde haue inſtruction might bee much profite iob firſt ſayeth according naturall vnderſtanding god ſmiteth without cauſe afterwarde moreouer let v marke theſe wordes without cauſe haue reſpect apparant opē knowledge men haue told heretofore god iuſtice knowne two wayes ſometimes god puniſheth ſinnes notorious worldwarde ye ſee god chaſtizeth ſuch one men haue knowne ſhameful whoremaſter full ſilthineſſe diſhoneſtie men haue knowne blaſphemer ſwearer men haue knowne drunkard ryotter men haue knowne giuen raking extortion vnfaithfulneſſe vvell god executeth iuſtice vpon ſuch one man ſeeth beholde god iudge ſuffereth crime ſcape vnpuniſhed alſo god iuſtice knowne ſecrete iudgements wee ſee god ſmite torment ſuch folke notable fault rather ſome vertues ye ſhall ſee ſometimes whole citie whole countrie put hauocke yee ſee put fire ſwoorde yea euen little babe nothing bee ſeene innocencie vvell yee ſee thing ſeeming ſtraunge cace muſt glorifie god yea euen though reaſon thereof bee open vntoo v god ſhewe v firſt day ſuffereth ordeyneth ſuch thing may wee diſpute aske doth demaunde reaſon yee ſee iob ment theſe wordes without cauſe meening god reſpect himſelfe puniſh men without cauſe haue ſayde afore vniuſte tyrannie hee taketh theſe woordes without cauſe reſpect whiche perceyue herein included wee muſt reuerence god iuſtice although hidden ouercaſt darke thicke cloudes yet muſt wee beleeue nothing right indifferencie although ſeeming naturall reaſon wee finde iuſtice god rather iuſtice tranſformed vnrightuouſneſſe yet muſt glorifie neuertheleſſe thus yee ſee iob ment ſaying hee wounded without cauſe wit man ſhoulde haue demaunded knoweſt thou euident cauſe thy ſelfe god puniſheth thee ſee none iob handled ſtraunge faſhion vvee haue ſeene howe hee mirrour caſtaway howe might ſeeme god minded vtter anger wrath agaynſt iob therefore ſawe ende god reaſon knowledge true hee ſpeaketh hypocriſie deede god reſpect puniſhed iob ſhoulde ſay hee wicked man therefore ought puniſhed men vvherefore bycauſe diuell accuſeth neither vprightneſſe ſoundneſſe god ment ſhould come trial men ſhould knowe what▪ one god intent puniſh iobs ſinnes like meaſure offended meane ſpared many▪ wicked men dealt ſo roughly ſo ſee iob blaſphemeth ſayth god woundeth without cauſe muche woorde ment ſimply ſpeaketh wit knew ſpeciall cauſe god puniſheth ſo according truth knew none doubt god ſhould vſe rigour poſsible agaynſt man like angel heauen walked ſoundneſſe perfection ſay god ſhould vtter rigour agaynſt yet ſhoulde hee iuſt rightuous ſtill yea verely yet without cauſe true take counſel braine diſcuſſe cace commeth owne fleſhly vnderſtanding wee ſhall ſay without cauſe without inquiſition without running heade behoueth v conclude foraſmuch god rightuous knoweth doth vvee ſee cauſe yet muſt glorifie lo plight iob addeth god giueth respite take breath feedeth bitterneſſe iob ſheweth beſides miſerie great exceſsiue doth alſo holde ſtill chiefe piece temptation god feedeth bitterneſſe ſay filleth ſuch wiſe anguiſh cannot finde ſo much one little ſcrappe goodneſſe refreſh may take courage ye ſee yet better howe god doth caſt ſeruants euen bottom graue thing ought marke well man v ſhall finde himſelfe ſore combered god turneth backe vpon v perceyue haue terrible countenance ſo ſhewe himſelfe angry v ala euen boldeſt moſt aduenterous ſo quayled ſee nothing death eye howe ſhall wee doo yet ſo weake feeble muche therefore doth ſtande v hande marke well theſe textes wit god onely hath giuen poore creature ſome ſigne anger alſo holdeth locked vp ſo woulde take winde drawe breath hope haue ſome little ſmack fauour alay grieſes withal god commeth ſtill increaſe miſerie seeing iob hath bin ſuch extremitie ſhould ſo to▪ therefore whenſoeuer meane aduerſitie let v prepare ſelues receyue grieuouſer pleaſeth god ſende vntill haue remedied miſeries thus ye ſee haue mark vpō text iob bewrayeth himſelfe openly anon ſaying ye ſpeake ſtrength like vnto god matter muſt come iuſtice ſummon find matter hold plea ſtoode vpon euen grounde none conclude ſayth god conſumeth righteous vnrighteous togither two wayes v recouer right men ſhal haue taken ought v wee go either force way iuſtice prince mainteyne theyr quarelles bloudſhedde priuate perſones woulde much might ſuffered alwayes woulde begin way deedes hardly withhold ſelues punniſhment ſo euer prepared alſo ordinarie meanes iuſtice iob taketh theſe thing ſhold ſay true find ſelf tormented extremitie yet notwithſtanding howe ſhall withſtand god fall violence ſhall gaine egall match go waye iuſtice receyue ſhall take vpon iudge vmper betwixt v whereat ſhall beginne plea ſhort ſee god conſumeth righteous wicked talke ſeemeth yet ſtraunge haue ſet downe howbeeit wee looke well may ſort make one thing verie good fit ſerue turne vvhereas iob ſayeth none match god ſtrength holde plea law bicauſe ſo much comaundement meeneth hereby impute vnto god ſuch lawleſſe power liſteth deale vniuſtly true ought aske none reaſon god hand good yet therwithall muſt hold certaintie god cannot otherwiſe iuſt rightfull though ſee ſo rather flat eōtrarie iob taketh ground vpō haue diſcourſed afore wit god iuſtice conſiſteth knowledge wee haue enter intoo man brayne vvherein conſiſteth ſelfe ſo wee muſte ſay hath god done well done hath god willed right rightfull fault bee founde howe may bee examine god doings wee ſhall finde reaſon cleane awke ſhould bee ſhall wee therevpon acknowledge bee rightuous howe poſsible touched afore namely god rightuouſneſſe iuſtneſſe conſiſteth ſelfe ſo needeth borrowe allowance let v thinke ſtraunge god requireth confeſsion handes ſhoulde v aſſure ſelues rightuous howe vnindifferent ſo euer ſeeme dealing ſo pray wit shall mortall men dare ſay able comprehende meaſure god rightuouſneſſe folly aſmuch eyeſight dimme haue much diſcerne one foote length afore v yee woulde ſay let v acknowledge owne meaſure able beare true eyeſight hild within boundes ſee worlde imagination fancy v nimble runne euery neuertheleſſe wee ſhall haue ſtied aboue heauens yet ſhall neuer atteyne ſo high maieſtie god certeſſe ſeeing cannot abide brightneſſe ſunne without dazeling eye ala ſhall attaine ſo highe reach height god rightuouſneſſe ſo nothing might bee hidde v ſhoulde paſſe examination let v marke well iob hath ſpoken god ſtrength rightuouſneſſe maner meening aforeſayde vſe exceſsiue forme ſpeache vvho ſhall go lawe god god giue eare inſueth god bee full ſufficient credite haue men tied vntoo ſhall ſpeake owne cace let v come backe againe concluſion fond vnreaſonable matter yea euen againſt kind god ſhoulde bee raunged ranke among men ſhould rightuous furtherfoorth maketh v priuie ſhoulde abace himſelfe fellow ſhould forget himſelfe ſhould ſtrip himſelfe owne godhead good reaſon god rightuouſneſſe ſhould haue preeminence whereas hee come account v whereas hee yeelde v reaſon doings yea euen doeth thing contrarie vnderſtanding reaſon yet withſtanding wee muſte aſſure ſelues rightuouſneſſe continueth whole ſounde bicauſe haue ſayd conſiſteth ſelfe herevpon iob concludeth god conſumeth rightuous vnrightuous nowe ſayth meete foraſmuche god rightuouſneſſe ſurmounteth capacitie man therefore hee ſhoulde mingle good bad ſo togither one veſſell dooth goodneſſe proceede vvhy dooth hee know doth auow fauourable god ſo conſume good bad alike ſhould ſeme hath rightuouſneſſe deede ye ſee alſo abraham reaſoneth eightenth geneſis lorde ſayth ſeemely thou ſhouldeſt deſtroy rightuous vnrightuous impoſsible howe iob ſpeaketh ſo vvee muſte alwayes holde ground iob dooth take rightuous vnrightuous found god rightuous wee come hee taketh rightuous vnrightuous according perceyuing ye ſee man ſhall bee rightuous ſay hee ſhall leade good honeſt lyfe hee ſhall walke feare god pureneſſe ſoundneſſe neighbour yet hee commeth heauenly throne thing wee ſee muſt needes bee diſcouered thus vnderſtanding ſee rightuous vnrightuous periſh god ſtriketh well one plage indifferent ſayde salomon ſhall therefore blaſpheme god muſt alwayes beare minde god iuſtice bee apparant vnto v ſay ſhewe openly puniſhing wicked deliuering good ſuche haue ſerued faithfully well wee haue glorifie behalf god iuſtice knowne v ſo ſeemeth hee confoundeth togither according imagination hee puniſhe rightuous vnrightuous togither yet let v therefore ceaſſe acknowlege confeſſe rightuous himſelf becommeth v glorifie caces reſpects vvhen take way although thing ſeme vtterly cōfuſed vnto v yet god giue v ſuche wiſedome wee ſhall acknowledge nothing done without reaſon yea thing ſeemeth preſently agaynſt v ſhall turned welfare lo exerciſes chriſtians herevntoo muſt wee applie indeuer vntill god haue called v home warres chiefeſt aſſault wherewith exerciſe v wee may giue glorie notwithſtanding ſeeme hee minded thunder downe vpon v nowe lette v fall flat preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo enter examination ſinnes wee ſhall haue knowne throughly may doubt hath v great aduauntage therevpon humble oure ſelues great ſmall v confeſſe ſelues indetted great iudge mortall life hee handle v roughly wee woulde ſende v affliction ouerſore contrarie fleſhe let v beſeech aſſuage although abate firſt daſh yet neuertheleſſe hee alwayes holde v vp ſtrong hande ſuffer satan inuegle v blaſphemie wee may acknowledge rightuouſneſſe honour vntill hee make v feele goodneſſe giuing v full fruition ſaluation ende wee may onely ſende vp ſighes beneath alſo crie vnto open mouth father may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation c xxxvj sermon fourth vpon ninth chapter 23 ſcourge kill hande ſhall laugh temptation innocent 24 earth giuen hande vvicked hee couereth face iudges vvhere vvho 25 dayes paſſed ſvviftly poſt inſomuch haue ſeene good 26 ſlipt avvay ſooner ſvvift ſhip flying eagle 27 ſay ſelfe vvill forgette complaint vvill appeaſe vvrath vvill comfort mee 38 afray de miſeries knovv thou vvilt iudge innocent wee may fare better thys doctrine muſt call remembrance hath bene ſayd heretofore namely howe iobs intent ſhewe god iuſtice appeareth alwayes vnto men ſo knowne ſayd men may touch finger rather god woorketh ſuch ſtraunge faſhion ſeemeth vnto v neither reaſon indifferencie maketh hotchpotch al thing haue tolde afore god iuſtice doth ſometimes ſhewe ſelfe certaine markes v diſcerne god puniſh wicked man none v hee thinketh v haue warning ſuch example wee bee compelled glorifie according ſayde hundreth ſeuenth pſalme god deliuer one calleth vpon hath walked feare ſay god rightuous hee keepeth one rate doo continually ſo hath ſecrete iudge ments incomprehenſible v inſomuche wee cannot bee abaſhed amazed god ſhall doo thing ſeeme bee quite agaynſt reaſon yee ſee howe iobs meening findeth himſelfe amazed bycauſe god ruleth owne mynde fancie hath another maner workes vtterly vnknowne vntoo v yee ſee ſayeth whip ſinyte kill howe ſhall god laugh temptation good men bycauſe ſentence darke ſhorte whiche cauſeth darkeneſſe hath bene expounded diuers wayes throughly conſidered right meening namely god ryſe vp agaynſt wicked howe dooth hee laugh trouble good ſpake afore witte baldad pretended god vttereth chaſtizements openly ſo ſoeuer men haue deſerued whenſoeuer haue done amiſſe god puniſheth bee ſhort hee ſeemed ſaying men alreadie come latter day iudgement iuſtice ſet full perfection howbeeit god reſerueth many thing ſo yee ſee god ſeemeth goueme thing confuzedly day ſhould puniſh ſinnes men woulde thinke ende come alreadie would hope lord ieſus chriſt ſhould gather v vp himſelf needefull v god ſhoulde leaue many faultes vnpuniſhed alſo needful good ſhould afflicted ſeeme haue loſt labour ſeruing god let v come iobs wordes ſcourge ſayth doth ſlea immediately ſay god make delay correction lift vp hande ſmite men ſoone haue ſinned vnto euery man according woorthineſſe deſeruings ſhoulde laugh affliction good men knowe iuſtice vprightneſſe conſiſt two partes wherof one puniſhing euil folke releeuing good folke mainteyning rightuous ſounde conuerſation therefore god puniſh wicked hee muſt alſo contrarie part mainteyne good ſo keepe vnder tuition ſuffer troubled tormēted bur may feele ſuccour ſo ſoone crie vnto howbeit ſee good puniſhed day two lingering paynes life long ſo ſtead ſhewing ſigne hee minded help ſeemeth god taketh vengeance purpoſed plunge thē bottomleſſe pit let v conclude haſtie puniſh wicked hand bringeth firſt brunt poynt men may ſay one hath done amiſſe therefore hee muſt bee puniſhed conuenient theſe two thing ioyned togither reaſon iob vſeth good ſame paule alſo ſetteth ſeconde epiſtle theſſalonians ſaying belongeth god rightuouſneſſe puniſh thoſe trouble good giue reliefe reſt ſuch ſhall haue bene oppreſſed wrongfully time one theſe point ſay cannot ſeparated wit god rightuous minde ſhewe perfectly world one ſide muſt haue eye vpon ſuch amiſſe ſuffer ſcape hand make thē come reckening ſide good men diſquieted haue wrōg violence offered muſt pitie ſhew hath hand ye ſee ſay theſe two thing ought match togither otherwiſe ſhoulde one part iuſtice god iuſtice ſhoulde whole perfect vve ſee iob hath good reaſon ſpeake ſo yet ſaid lifted vp himſelfe maliciouſly agaynſt god haue declared heretofore intent ſhew god rightuouſneſſe alwayes apparant muſt take generall rule ſoone men haue ſinned god hath hand bent puniſh contrarie part wil firſt brunt ſhew himſelf preſeruer good ridding miſeries muſt come poynt bicauſe god rightuouſneſſe ſhould alwayes knowne vnto v rather ſhewe v enter time iudgemēts behoueth v humble ſelues whenſoeuer vſeth maner dealing ſhal quite contrarie fancy muſt preſume murmur againſt muſt reuerence theſe great ſecretes far aboue capacitie vntill ſuch time may comprehend hiddē v ye ſee iobs meening true ceaſſed tormented exceſsiue paſsion therefore let v learne hereby behoueth v hūble ſelues god although deale ſuch ſtraunge faſhiō v perceiue nother equitie vprightneſſe yet notwithſtanding muſt caſt downe eye haue inclination murmur agaynſt god doth thing comprehende owne reaſon ſame ſpecially ſhew ſelf ſcourgeth v wee ſpurred repine againſt ſaying meeneth doth god pitie lo men wexe wood god handleth otherwiſe like yet ſo iob fought agaynſt ſuch temptation let v marke iob knew god rightuous fully perſwaded thereof generall came incounter miſchief preſſed driuen backe inforced chafe agaynſt god furthermore reſtingpoynt wherof haue ſpokē ſuch cōfort themſelues afflictiōs muſt alwayes haue eye rule iob taketh ſcourged god hand bicauſe euill doer god puniſheth men according deſerts becōmeth v taske ſo ordinarie maner proceeding hath iudgements incōprehenſible v ye ſee iob ſpeaketh confirme matter ſayth ſee good pine away god helpeth thē ſuffereth thē continue anguiſh yeare two yea time life maketh coūtenance cōming towards poore forlorne folke god leaue good folke maner neceſsities ſhould ſaid whip ſtriketh hand ſay god haſtie puniſhing men offence ſinnes vve ſee cleane cōtrary herevpon gather muſt thinke ſelues ſcaped god hand hauing done neighbour ſhrewd turne bee eaſe time let v beware flatter ſelues whē god beareth v let v vnderſtand meanes meeneth draw v repētance abuſeſt thou god pacience ſayth paule ſpeaking ſuch wilful naughtineſſe true god wil haue pitie vpon ſuch returne vnto aske forgiueneſſe faultes yet doth therfore follow hee caſt away thoſe ſcourgeth thys worlde let v marke god puniſheth men ſone haue done amiſſe yet followeth therefore acquit ſhall neuer called account nay rather bicauſe god giueth v reſpite returne mercie beſeech receiue v mercie therefore ſee wicked triumph ſcoffe god yet preſſed hande let v miſgreeued therat though god giuen vp office longer iudge worlde let v wayte till time come lorde may well delay correction intendeth ſende ſide time may ſeeme long vnto v yet muſt reſtreyne mindes hold ſhort knowing god puniſh ſinnes worlde preſently hee knoweth reaſon good ynoughe hee ſhould ſo haue ſayde alreadie meening holde v alwayes ſuſpence wee might worſhip call vpon vntill thing ſet order good ſtate thus yee ſee ſo greate ſtore mingling ſo long worlde indureth bicauſe god intendeth exercize v fayth hope ende ſhould wayte comming lorde ieſus chriſt whiche time ſhall ſet vp thing full perfectly ſo intermedled touching iob addeth god laugheth temptation innocent ſpeaketh vnderſtanding man muſt imagine god ſporteth himſelfe affliction good men vve know loue beareth v cannot expreſſe ſufficiently howe tender ſame ſaying bee vnto apple hys eye let v thinke god ſo cruel towards v laugh torment howbeit imagine none otherwiſe f • eſh yea thinke thus ſelues lord thou knowſt miſerie wherin cal vpō thee ſigh thee feele fraile yet thou letteſt alone ſtil perceyue thou intendeſt helpe meanes theſe thing conſidered conclude ſelues god doth nothing laugh v heauen behoueth v vnderſtād faith whē god doth ſo diſcountenance matter ceaſſeth haue pitie vpon v true hee ſheweth hand neuertheleſſe ought ſuffize v beeing father v loueth v much wiſh ieſus chriſt ſheweth fleſhly father euil nature loue child ſhall god fountaine goodneſſe let v thinke god laugheth v lette v rather conſider hys diſcountenauncing matter nothing elſe exerciſe v meane time ceaſſeth watch ouer v ſuccour v ſuch maner wee knowe thus much concerning ſentence iob addeth earth deliuered intoo hande wicked eye iudges turned aſide ſay ſuche ought redreſſe trouble offence miſorders committed guiltie ſayeth hee effect iob ſheweth preſent life thing ſhall ſo mingled togyther men ſhall ſay knowe white black earth ſhall deliuered handes wicked ſay men ſhal ſee wicked haue theirfull ſcope ſuche moſt vnruly moſt looce lyfe fighter ſeditious full vngraciouſneſſe ſo nother vprightneſſe humanitie ſhall haue thing therefore wee ſee god giue bridle wicked ſuche ſort bee ſayde one onely remedie thoſe whiche beare warder iuſtice ſhould repreſſe ſuch vexe good men faſhion contrarywiſe bee ſeene ſo giuen themſelues lette go hauocke vvhat ſayd magiſtrates ought yeeld euery man right ſuffer wicked doo worſt man ſhall find reliefe hand ſhall haue wayted haue dutie purpoſe idol cauſe blame ſayeth iob god god gouerner earth ought wicked bee rooted elſe beare lay raynes brydle neck vexe trouble good men without ſtopping purpoſe may ſayde god doth geere otherſide ſayd god office gouerne ſuche holy ſpirite walke feare modeſtie moreouer telleth v hath ſtabliſhed ciuill ſtate world iudges haue nother wiſdome diſcretion hand seing god leaueth magiſtrats ſo blind idol ſo lazie haue neither courage inclination maynteyne good puniſh euill bodie blamed god ſayd iob true ſentence may expounded otherwyſe wee muſt ſtand vpon diuerſitie expoſitions wee muſt haue eye onely naturall meening thus ye ſee effect iob ment ſay vpon verſe wee haue good leſſon gather firſt wee ſee thing ſo diſordered wicked triumph weltring pleaſures inioying abundance goodes man gainſaying working exceſſes age without touche breſt muſt conſider howe new thing ſhould greatly aſtoniſhed ſuche temptation good yea needfull v bee armed agaynſt ſuche imagination vvee ſee howe owne minde driueth v therevnto ſo thing fall according fancie ſeemeth v al thing turned fortune god regardeth worlde rather hee forſloweth duetie aſleepe elſe regardeth neither good euill lo fancy runne heades reſtreyned according scripture telleth v wee ought thinke ſtraunge though earth deliuered ſort intoo hande wicked ſinnes deſerue wicked ſhould haue full power ouer v wee obeyed god becommeth v certaine thing ſhould ruled ſuch faſhion ſhoulde bee contented foraſmuch bee ſtubborne againſt god play horſes broken looce good reaſon alſo ſhould giue wicked ſcope ende might chaſtized hand ſo vnthankfulneſſe deſerueth well god ſhoulde bring forth roddes make v feele al rigour therefore knowne v thinke ſtraunge ſight ſee thing ſo cōfounded may ſay earth deliuered handes wicked wee ſhoulde ſighe comming thereof paſſe bycauſe god giueth v warning ſinnes verely haue good cauſe ſigh ſeeing wicked deſpyzers god muſt onely defile earth alſo haue full ſcope god hath created men owne image put thing hande intent ſhoulde bee lieutenant behold wicked ſuch ſeeke nothing offende god deface maieſtie glorie diſplace child hath appointed owne heritage vvhen wee ſee thing thus turned topſitoruie muſt needes grone muſt prouoke v pray god vouchſafe ſet thing againe right ſtate furthermore ſayde god hee ſhutteth eye iudges let v marke howe much ſay haue adminiſtration iuſtice committed vnto cannot haue minde except giuen aboue man able gouerne himſelfe ſhall gouerne whole realme▪ furthermore matter great preeminence execute god office worlde therefore god muſt bee fayne worke thoſe hath ſette high eſtate authoritie party themſelues muſt bee ſo much earneſter calling vpon god may pleaſe guide thē helpe man thinke himſelf ſufficient abilitie ſet ſiege iuſtice truſt owne wiſdome power god laugh ſcorne make blockheade therefore god choozeth muſt humble themſelues ſo much preſume vpō thing them▪ ſelues muſt craue ſpirite wiſedome ſpirite ſtoutneſſe ſpirit vprightneſſe god may giue power abilitie diſcharge duty faythfully thus yee ſee howe magiſtrates ought betake themſelues vntoo god care feare alſo vnder muſte v parte doo like bee iuſtice among v beholde curſe god vpon v lande muſte bee defyled ſo farre tyll god poure hys vttermoſte wrath vpon v meane wee oure ſelues muſte bothe ſuffer ſee good men ſuffer none maynteyned ought seeing welfare whole realme god giueth ſpirite prince magiſtrates men law v cal vpon ſuffer blinded vnable diſcerne aught blockiſhe though ſaw euil doings cōmitted like muſt ſewe grace goodneſſe god may pleaſe graunt ſpirite vnto magiſtrates ſo muſt wee alſo pray giue v ſuch ſtrength ſtoutneſſe wee may bee heart wee ſee thing go amiſſe wee ſee go much yea euill worſe ſo magiſtrates ſtead riſing vp ſee neede beeing readie hande mainteine right knowing thēſelues bee ordeyned god ſame purpoſe fauour mainteyne euill let v aſſure ſelues god hath forſaken thereby ſheweth hee hath withdrawne himſelfe v bycauſe wee bee worthie haue ſit among v hath promiſed doo among ſuch conformable vnto thus ye ſee fruite diſobedience ſinnes god ſhall ſuffer ciuill order bee ouerthrowne among v thing may bee confounded wee haue well deſerued ſo wee ſee ſuche trouble confuzion among v let v aſſure ſelues god puniſheth v taketh away al diſcretion vnderſtanding iudges ſort bicauſe hee hath ſtriken ſpirite giddyneſſe ſayde scripture yet muſt wee murmure agaynſt god aſſuring ſelues hee dooth thing without cauſe although wee cannot perceyue iob meeneth ſaying ſhewe haue ſought reaſons ſo muche euill done worlde wee muſt euermore come vnto god scripture ſayeth god dooth good euill meeneth thing proceede whether bee proſperitie aduerſitie lyfe death light darkeneſſe ſayde prophete eſay inſomuche whatſoeuer diuell doth haue ſayde afore whatſoeuer wicked ſorte doo attempt wee muſte take ſame hande god vnleſſe hee gaue brydle coulde attempt thing whatſoeuer deuiſed coulde neuer bring paſſe fayre martyring man ſelf leaue god ſeke inferiour meanes belongeth god gouern ſoueraine dominion ouer creature would go wrecke although men ſeeke nothing rebell againſt yet doth ſerue turne ſpite teeth iob ment vtter ſaying vvhē happeneth miſchiefe let men ſearch ſaying hath done true euill happeneth well skill make diſcourſes ſeeke ſome ground beneath bee countrey king prince reigneth tyrannically men ſay beholde king fleeceth deuoureth people moreouer maketh none accoūt miniſtring iuſtice hath officer like himſelfe ſeeke intrappe men ouerturned order ſeene none ſhift realme muſte come vtter decay blamed complaint ſhall heard herevpon marked men togither frowarde naughtie haue prouoked god wrath agaynſt bee folke giuen lewdneſſe deſpizers god looce life poyntes reſpects ſo ſhoulde ſeeme deſirous kindle fire god wrath burne vp men may well alledge lewdneſſe gouerners nation ſo miſordered maner yet muſt mount vp higher let v thinke god aſleepe heauen hath forgotten worlde rather let v aſſure ſelues hee worketh owne hande ſinnes people cauſe officer men law wicked ſame cauſe god alſo fayne ſhake make mirrours wrath vengeance let v ſo cōſider inferiour cauſes meanes may neuertheleſſe perceyue reaſon vnderſtanding god abydeth continually ſoueraine dominion may know thing come yet notwithſtanding wee ſhall alwayes knowe cauſe god worketh ſo vvhen wee ſhall haue ſearched vttermoſt made great circuites diſcourſes end ſhall dazled ſee reaſon god doth vvhat bee done wee muſt honour iuſtice god vnknowne v true ſometimes god worketh ſuch wiſe iuſtice fully apparant men may ſee eye ſometimes alſo hidden cace haue honour ſay ala lorde thy iudgements bottomleſſe pit wherevnto wee bee able attaine yet wee ceaſſe confeſſe thou art righteous although wee perceyue reaſon howbeit muſt ſurmyze men well practized scripture thing done bylowe god ſufferance without caring medling much cut power one aſleepe heauen left ruling worlde beneath eyther satan men ſay vtter defacing god maieſtie meete ſhoulde order hee hath made ſame ſhoulde proceede good diſpoſition true hath beene ſayde ſee alwayes howe god rightuous yet muſte wee acknowledge bee ſo wee muſte walke ſoberneſſe modeſtie ende god make v knowe hidden v nowe let v come iob addeth ſayeth dayes gone away ſwiftly poste ſhippe vnder ſayle therefore alſo flying woorde ſette downe expreſſe better iob ſpeaketh ſome greate ſhip full fraughted ſome little pinneſſe may ſerue make ſporte paſtime vpon water turneth nimbly goeth away apace therefore hee likeneth life little pinneſſe light glydeth ſwiftly vpon water withall hee compareth alſo poſte finally aegle ſoreth ayre ſeeke hir pray heere iob ſheweth howe ſore hee caryed away paſsions pleaſed holy ghoſt preſident ſhould bee gyuen v intent euery v ſhoulde perſone iob beholde maye happen himſelfe fare wee god ſcourgeth v lo temptation driue v deſpayre whiche wee forgette gracious goodneſſe god hath done v wee coulde bethinke v benefites wee haue receyued god hande haue ſeene iob ſay heretofore certain ſame would make v forget ſorrowes vvell god doth nowe ſmyte mee haue receyued muche good hande hee hath ſhewed himſelfe bountifull towardes mee ende ſhould alwayes taſte mercie ſhoulde truſt flee therevnto refuge wee cannot eate one bit breade ſame witneſſe vnto v god goodneſſe alwayes father sauiour beholde heere ineſtimable remedie ſweeten ſorrowes whenſoeuer wee bee afflicted calling minde benefites gracious giftes wee haue receyued god hand satan ſeeth well vſeth cleane contrarie policie whiche make v forget good god hath doone v beſtowed vpon v ende wee might haue nothing v anguiſh ſet v fretting might nothing bitterneſſe nothing might cheere v comfort v trouble iob ſheweth v nowe dayes ſayeth hee ſlipt away like little pinneſſe go ſwiftly vppon water elſe eagle flying ayre lackey goeth poste hereby hee dooth v witte hee remembreth howe god cauſed borne worlde giuen ſo many token fatherly loue might well haue wherewith comfort himſelfe yea ſuch regard conſideration requiſite true iob kept alwayes ſtill ſome taſte god goodneſſe ſo neuer deſpayre verely although tormented toſſed fro yet alwayes ſuch vnderſtanding ſtill hilde ſuch awe hee knewe god bee rightuous alſo wayted bee deliuered miſeries wee ſee ſuch temptation behoueth euery v haue eye himſelf behold himſelf deede although god ſhewe v fauour make v taſte continually goodneſſe yet notwithſtanding know ſufficiently fully wel loueth v rather hee trouble v wee quite forget good hee hath done v ſeeming wee neuer receyued benefite hande nowe ſith wee ſee ſuche temptation befell vntoo iob ſo muche behoueth v bee fenced blowe come let v take warning ſay oft god ſhall ſend v trouble let v thinke thus yea god neuer doo mee good good loſt hee beſtowed vpon mee beare minde purpoſe ſhall ſerue mee procure double puniſhmentes mine vnthankfulneſſe lo wee haue marke foraſmuch life ouerbrickle let euery v inforce himſelfe thinke vpon gracious goodneſſe benefites god wee fall aduerſitie wee muſt runne remedie pray vnto god ſtrengthen v withholde v murmuring agaynſt yea whatſoeuer tribulation wee driuen indure fully aſſuring ſelues wee church body lord ieſus chriſt wee muſt bee made like vnto image glory prepared v aboue heauen ynough recompence tribulation wee indure worlde bethinking thing ſerue well aſſwage oure ſorrowes finally iob concludeth hee ſay hee forget complaint refreſhe himſelfe ſayde greefe torment hee cannot vvhy ſo ſayeth hee afrayde bycauſe know thou wilt leaue mee vnpuniſhed thou wilt holde mee giltleſſe effect iobs meening ſentence foraſmuch hath god finde releefe aduerſitie heauineſſe although purpoſe ſo yea inforce himſelfe bring paſſe yet dooth god holde ſhet vp ſo cannot haue reſte himſelfe notable ſentence haue earſt ſeene heretofore haue doo men may ſtill haue ſome ſtartingholes wee may ſlink aſide couert ſay find ſome meane ſhift ſelfe ſuche man hand although hee lion gape open mouth deuour yet maye ſtill ſcape haue deale men may ſtill finde ſome ſcapingplace god ſhew aduerſarie holde v ſtaues ende make v ſay beholde god puniſheth mee behold god troubleth may peraduenture writh ſelues hither thither make fetch worlde yet wee haue ſtyed aboue cloudes oure skill god ſtill higher higher aboue v go bottome deepes hand well reache thither v paſſe ouer sea hand ſhall ſtretch yet farre therfore let v learne knowe muſte ſeeke ſtartingholes wee haue god muſte appeare cyteth v wee ſhall gayne nothing delaying alſo let v learne flatter oure ſelues woont behold vſe wherevnto doctrine ought ſerue v ſee hypocriſie men ſhould come right forth afore god without diſsimulation diſcouer oure harte meete hee ſhoulde ſearche v quicke cannnot hide thing ought doo therefore peace god let v beware vſe none fonde toyes wherwith woont beguyle ſelues let v walk feare carefulneſſe let v pray pleaſe ſcourge v maye bee ſuche meaſure maketh v feele diſpleaſure wee may ceaſſe taſte goodneſſe ſame may ſerue v aſſwage ſorrowes ſo may doubt hand v deliuer v ſhall perceyue welfare profit yea euē bicauſe haue called vpon thus ye ſee ſort ought put leſſon vre reſidue god willing ſhall bee diſcourſed morrow let v caſt ſelues maieſtie good god acknowledgemēt fault praying make v feele ſuche wiſe wee may inſtructed lowlineſſe yea euen glorifie tribulation beeing well aſſured wee haue deſerued hundred thouſand tymes mo miſeries ſendeth v ſpecially may know holdeth v vp ſpareth v continually euen fatherly goodneſſe intent therfore may leade v glorifie magnifie walke feare vntill ſuche time hauing withdrawen v quyte trouble hinderance hold v backe nowe hee make v attaine knowledge thing deepe v yet let v pray guyde v ſuche wiſe holy ſpirite wee may honour ſecretes till hee giue v full ſight make v feele experience hath bene father sauiour wee ſhall haue obeyed true child may pleaſe graūt grace v alſo people nation earth c xxxvij sermon fift vpon ninth chapter sermon treateth ſtill vpon xxvij xxviij verſes vpon thoſe followe 29 bee vvicked vvhy labour vaine 30 vvaſhe ſelfe cleare vvater make handes pure cleane 31 thou vvilt plundge mee myre mine ovvne clothes ſhall defile mee 22 hee man might beebolde anſvvere vvee might go lavve togither 33 vvho vmper vvill put hande betvvixt v 34 let take rod avvay mee let fraye mee 35 vvill ſpeake bee afraide holde mee ſtill bicauſe ſo haue begonne alreadie expound ſentence iob ſayeth hee hath reſte bicauſe god purſueth reaſon whereof hee diſmayde aduerſities wee ſuffer trouble men handes wee may find ſome meanes reſiſt wee knowe god againſt v ye ſhall ſee v ſo incombred may well ſeeke remedy wee ſhall finde none till god one v bicauſe bene layde iobs charge ment iuſtifie himſelf god bene tolde ſhould gaine nothing ſo addeth vvell wicked trouble ſelfe vayne heere iob pleadeth giltie howbeit ſuche wiſe freendes tolde ſpake effect enemy vvhy ſo intended haue hild condemned caytife deſpizer god caſtaway howbeit iob graū teth hee ſayeth hee offender ment god ſecrete iudgement ſhoulde bee entered hee ſhoulde ſay haue fayre pleading cace ſhall haue iuſtified lyfe afore men yet ſhall alwaies condemned afore god hee liſt enter rigour agaynſt mee wee muſt alwayes turne backe againe grounde wee haue ſpoken heeretofore wit god may well allow v ſhall haue ſerued honoured yet notwithſtanding hee ſhall bring v ſecrete iuſtice whiche rule rightuouſneſſe whiche hee ſtandeth accepteth wee ſhall nothing euer v muſt needes vtterly defaced requireth larger declaration otherwiſe bee vnderſtoode truely according rule god hath giuen v law mortall wight found rightuous perfect loue required ſay wee loue god hart neighbour oure ſelues forſomuch wee fayle loue towards god charitie towards neighbour condemned god lawe heere wee ſee paule alledging text curſed perſourmeth thing conteyned law concludeth thervpon rightuouſneſſe among men hope ſaluation reſt vpon workes vvhy ſo doth follow bicauſe tranſgreſſors law curſed therfore men ſhould ſo yea verely bee found whiche haue walked according god law meane full perfection haue miſſed one poynt giltie bicauſe iames ſayeth hee hath forbiddē murther hath alſo forbidden ſteale vvhē wee ſhall haue offended god maieſtie haue
