wrought agaynſt rightuouſneſſe muſte wee needes come ſhorte rightuouſneſſe marke ſpeciall poynte god enter intoo account v according rule conteyned lawe hee ſhall finde ſo muche one rightuous man whole worlde yet notwithſtanding meane whyle walke feare god howbeit owne nature howe fayre ſhewe ſoeuer wee make certaine till god gouerne v ſpirite holineſſe men perceyue v hypocriſie vntruth god touche harte write lawe within ſame ſhall obey howbeit throughly ſuch perfect ſoundneſſe wee may come boldely god bee acquit neuertheleſſe greate diuerſitie betweene deſpizers god faythfull although faythfull man haue manye infirmity cannot walke ſo right fayne would yet notwithſtanding hee hath deſire ſerue god laboreth inforceth himſelfe wheras faithleſſe taketh ſcorne goodneſſe caſting god making none account giuen owne ſenſualitie wee ſee ſome may called rightuous deſerue accepted ſo god finding perfect rightuouſneſſe men neyther ſayde god beholding may go lawe haue deſerued well hand cannot find fault life ſpeake another rightuouſneſſe whiche god accepteth owne free goodneſſe wee ſpeake rightuouſneſſe halfe one whiche maye bee rightly cōdemned howbeit condemned bicauſe god imputeth fault imperfection faithfull one iob doth tearme himſelfe wicked man maner lawleſſe aweleſſe perſon ye ſhall ſee whoremōger ſhall giuē filthineſſe mocke god full ye ſhall ſee cruell man giuen extortion yee ſhall ſee blaſphemer ſwearer theſe maner men wicked conuerſation naughtineſſe ſo farre oute ſquare ought good right hold accurſed iob graunteth himſelfe ſuch one lyed wee ſhall ſee heereafter hee proteſteth himſelfe haue bene foſterer fatherleſſe ſuccourer widowes eye blinde bearer vp feeble weake bee ſhort hee angelicall ſoundneſſe bee cōpared men ſenſe doth cōdemne himſelfe wicked man ſentēce doth hypocriſie▪ ſayde afore bicauſe enter ſecrete iuſtice god muſt needes bee caſt ſhall well alledge lord thy hāde haue receyued grace yeelding ſelf thy ſeruice although haue walked ſo perfectly ought yet notwithſtanding marke amed haue applied mine indeuer way ſo minde none haue giuen ſelfe wholly therevnto true blame worthie many thing howbeit haue ſhrūke away frō thee time iob might well haue proteſted al ſayd rigorous iuſtice muſt needes haue mouth ſhet although men maye well ſhewe themſelues haue ſome deſire well▪ yet nothing worth thus yee ſee iob ment ſentence therfore let v marke well whoſoeuer wee ſhall haue fayre ſhew▪ meane men euen angel heauen although haue labored ſerue god without diſsimulation yet ynough iuſtifie v vvhy ſo enter accounte god rightuouſneſſe wee haue muſt needes waſh away come naught sainct paule ſpeaking charge onely whole life ſayeth hath ought whereat cōſcience may repine might bee blamed iuſtly yet notwithſtanding woulde iuſtifie himſelfe place ſpeaketh one thing namely hee preached goſpell good zeale yet confeſſeth ſhall iuſtified god finde fault ynowe himſelf wiſt paule ſpeaking office apoſtleſhip ſtoode vpon poynt bicauſe knewe well god coulde condemne many thing vnknowen himſelfe ſhall wee come examination whole lyfe ſhall god ſhall enter action againſt v ſome one matter matter yea euen oure woordes thoughtes alonely oure woorkes neuertheleſſe wee muſte alwayes come backe poynte namely iob ſpeaketh alonely rigour lawe whiche vnable bee borne ſerueth ouerwhelme v euery whit v alſo mounteth yet higher ſayde iuſtice whiche vnknowen vntoo v notwithſtanding hee addeth vvhy laboure vaine thereby hee ſheweth himſelfe haue exceſsiue paſsion hee yeeldeth wholly vntoo certayne hee hath reſiſted hee ſpeaketh affection fleſhe ſaying verie well yeelde ſelfe giltie confeſſe ſinner confeſſe wicked take payne purpoſe god perſecutes mee heere thoughe condemne ſelfe yet neuer eaſed meete god ſhoulde ouerwhelme mee firſte blowe vvhy wiped oute worlde dooth god take pleaſure holde mee ſo long pyning seeyng acknowledge ſelfe woorthie bee condemned woulde hee haue lo howe iob ſpeaketh heere man rage haue tolde heeretoofore although faithfull doo fight agaynſte temptation yet myſſe bee ſhaken feele ſuch aſſaults wote bee thing whiche iob confeſſeth verely hee prouoked herevnto▪ temptation thoſe galled though hee gone make part good againſt god addeth immediatly conteyneth certayne declaration hee ſayeth waſhe ſelfe water ſo make ſelfe throughly cleane god ſhall caste mee myre ſhall bee plunged filthineſſe inſomuch mine owne apparell ſhall defile mee ſay ſhall haue clenſed ſelfe well ſame cleaneneſſe mine whiche preſent beareth goodly ſhewe ſhall bee dung filth aſore god heere iob continueth ſtill matter ſhewe wee haue well examined lyfe ſhall bee founde oure fearing god obeying proceeded wholly grace hee gaue v yet ſame dooyng nothing muſte alwayes beare minde god maieſtie hydden v ſame maieſtie certaine rightfulneſſe comprehend true god hath well giuen v paterne image rightfulneſſe lawe howbeit according capacitie behoueth v know reaſon ſo groſſe cannot mount ſo high conceyue perfectly god verye rightuouſneſſe whiche conteyned god lawe rightuouſneſſe bounded within meaſure man capacitie vvee doo rightlye call perfect rightuouſneſſe ſo may name yea scripture tearmeth perfect rightuouſneſſe ebeit reſpect v ſaye reſpect creature meene reſpect v wee bee ſinners wee curſed adam reſpect v god creature yea take away difficultie euen reſpect angelles rightuouſneſſe ſuch rightuouſneſſe angelles men ought yeelde vntoo god obeying pleaſing yea euen much bee creature yet another higher rightuouſneſſe god ſaye perfect ryghtuouſneſſe wherevntoo wee bee able attayne neyther wee bee able come whitte neere vntill wee bee made like vnto haue function glorie hid v yet wee ſee glaſſe darkely ſhall wee bee farre thing wee bee thus yee ſee iob telleth v though hee waſhe himſelfe yet ſhall hee bee founde vncleane neuertheleſſe although ſpeake vvater snowe yet notwithſtanding reſemblance hee meeneth cleanneſſe men according ſayde waſhe handes innocencie vvhen dauid ſpake ſo hee eye ceremonie lawe forſomuche god men ſhould make themſelues cleane came temple pray reaſon bicauſe wee bee ſullyed full filte therfore behoueth v bee made cleane wee preſent ſelues god howe may bee done water bee ſpirituall waſhing ſoules muſte wee take ceremonie lawe figure thing muſt ſelues wit wee muſte renounce lewde affection haue pure cleane hart muſt renounce wicked work dedicate member ſerue god perfectly waſhing wherof iob ſpeaketh ſhort ſaying hee ſhould inforce himſelf ſerue god yea euen ſuch wiſe hee ſhoulde become white snow yet ſhould god finde ſomwhat worthie blame hee plundge mee ſayth behold heere ſtraunge maner ſpeaking god ſhoulde plundge myre howe propertie god put ſoyle v know hee fountaine holineſſe yea wee full filthineſſe wee flee helpe bee purged made cleane vvherefore iob ſayeth god plundge myre meening god diſcouer vncleanneſſe whiche perceyued afore howe hee diſcouer onelie lawe true onelye lawe god ynoughe condemne men haue ſayde afore heere yee ſee lawe called meſſage death namely bicauſe haue doctrine conteyned lawe wee ſhall bee vtterly ouer whelmed afore god wee ſhall bee caſte away without remedie god indite v according forme lawe ſhall diſcouer filthineſſe ynoughe v iob ſteppeth yet wit although ſayde pureneſſe according lawe ſay althoughe wee perfourmed euer god commaundeth impoſsible men doo yet wee ſtande let v put cace iob angell hee able go godwarde according rightuouſneſſe lawe yet ſhoulde hee alwayes finde himſelfe behinde hande reſpect ſecrete rightfulneſſe god ſayde verie angelles able ſtande afore hee liſted enter reckening iob therefore ſentence meeneth euen hee ſhall bee pure pure may bee meene according rightuouſneſſe lawe ſhall dung filth commeth afore god behold heere leſſon ought make fleſh ſtoupe ſhall haue weyed well thing conteyned therein true ordinarie doctrine holye scripture men looke vppon themſelues ſee whether haue fulfilled god lawe ſhall finde themſelues condemned beholde ſay wherevnto holy scripiure bringeth v backe wherefore wee know pride hypocriſie v vvee bee ſo proude ſtoupe god except compelled oure lorde preſſe v ſecrete rightfulneſſe whereof mention made heere thing bee wee play horſes broken looce wee ſet vp horne doſſe agaynſt god wee ſee vnbeleeuers doo blaſpheme full mouthe althoughe bee conuicted ſo theyr owne conſcience reprooueth knowe ſay themſelues yet notwithſtanding mouthe ſtill open rayle god grudge againſt ſpite theyr pleaſure therefore requiſite god ſhoulde haue way condemne v peculiar nature abate pride hypocriſie v heere yee ſee god bringeth v lawe telleth v vtterly forlorne hee ſhoulde ſaye well ſee euerye ſootheth himſelfe ſtandeth muche owne conceyte yee cannot brought reaſon made ſubmit ſelues ſewe agaynſte ſelfe gyue looking glaſſe lawe woulde haue euery one beholde himſelfe looke whether yee fayre come wee lawe god euery man ſees owne filthineſſe whereas earſt ſeeming nothing life welfare wonderfull ſtuffe v nowe wee bee ſtarke dead sainct paule ſpeaketh yea verely wee vnderſtande god lawe wee ought doo many haue vayle ſtill theyr eye beare themſelues hande haue ſerued god well ſo long lawe layde aſyde thinke themſelues haue performed full yet neuer came neere suche folke haue ſcarffe theyr eye wee conſider god lawe ſhall finde nothing filthineſſe iniquitie v yee ſee wherfore god toucheth v ſuche maner beholde yet higher meening ſentence according alſo iob ſpeaketh perfecter ſorte wit neuer righteouſneſſe lawe ſhall bee able ſtande afore god hee liſte deale rigorouſly v heere man might caſte doubt ſaye god condemne men ſhall haue perfourmed hee commaundeth appoynteth matter god hee may ſurely hee let ſuffize v wee haue ruled life well according god lawe ſhall bee accepted rightuous certaine ſayde hee dooth theſe thing ſhall liue promiſe deceyue v vntruth howſoeuer cace ſtand alwayes ſure grounde wee ſhall haue obeyed god lawe full atteyned ſayde pureneſſe ſo greate required whiche impoſsible thing mortall men doo yet notwithſtanding god needeth content himſelfe except liſt ſay finde ſuch perfectneſſe himſelfe bring ſhal bee nothing yet doth ſo ſayde afore iob mente ſaying god plundge myre whē ſhall haue waſhed himſelfe ſay god finde meanes ſhake mee wretched vnperfite creature although haue giuen minde pureneſſe life might bee ruled lawe ordinance woorkes might good holy yet notwithſtanding ſayde pureneſſe ſhall bee filth god rightfulneſſe paſſe vpon haue ſayde alreadie preſent leſſon ought well aſtoniſhe v though pure angelles yet wee able ſtande grace god ſo farre forth hee vpholdeth v creature withoute vſing rigour agaynſt v hee liſted handle v wee deſerue howe ſhould god may ouerwhelme like angel ala cauſe ſhoulde auaunce ſelues ſeeing drink ſinne fiſhe ſucketh water according ſayde ſelfe ſame booke ſeeing ceaſſe go agaynſt rule hee hath giuen v ſeeing wee perceyue ſome one condemnation hundred thouſand yea infinite number condemnation v ala ſhall become man pride hereby wee ſee rage rather furie hath bin ſtill popedome alledging owne merites wretched folke ſo puffed vp pryde weene themſelues able purchaſe paradiſe amiſſe anye poynt haue meanes theyr owne recompence god haue ſatisfactions haue theyr woorkes ouerpluſſe ſupererogation terme theſe payment diſcharge thēſelues againſt god deuill muſte needes haue witched men could ſo beare themſelues hand able binde god thir work ſo let v wey well doctrine way let v repreſſe affection hold ſhorte wee come ſame poynt iob hee reſted vpon poynt bene blaſphemie hee confeſſeth himſelfe haue beene tempted haue beene prouoked ſay go god man might bee bolde anſwere might go lawe togither ſome body might take vpon bee vmper betwixt v woulde ſpeake freely bee afrayde god woulde gyue leaue holde plea ſuffer iudge ſet ouer v coulde talke boldly againſt beholde right daungerous temptation ſayde afore iob concluded therevpon himſelfe beene curſed blaſphemie therefore ſheweth toſſed temptation howbeit withſtood may happen alſo ſhall bee ſuch trouble time vnto man vnderſtanding verie ſtraunge thing wee ſhall haue kept god lawe ſay poſsible bee doone yet wee ſhall bee diſcharged men haue alwayes ſome replie cace leaſt lament ſtate make moane ſaying poſsible god ſhoulde deale ſo rygorouſly v oure fulfilling lawe ſhoulde bee nothing woorth men haue cace whiche themſelues ſhall thinke bee verie worthie fauour ſo ſhall ſeeme bee worldewarde wee bee egged ſort wee muſte holde ſelues awe learne know god rightfulneſſe wee cannot comprehende nowe hidden v intent ſhoulde honor wee haue two wayes magnifie god one according maner manifeſting himſelfe vntoo v yee ſee howe god dooth lawe ſhewe himſelfe iudge condemne v goſpell hee ſheweth himſelfe father acquit v ſay commaundeth v thing good rightuous therewithall threatneth v haue fayled thing wee muſte accurſed god ſheweth himſelfe maner wee haue wherefore glorifie acknowledge hee rightuous howeſoeuer cace ſtande wee periſhe yet haue wee cauſe grudge agayne god call v himſelfe offering v grace oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſhewing hee deſireth nothing one v ye ſee yet greater cauſe glorifie rightuouſneſſe foraſmuche hee hath pulled v oute hell reached v hande yee ſee howe wee muſte glorifie god double wiſe hee vttereth himſelfe vntoo v woorde muche ſayde woorke vvhen god beareth v hys mercie let v vnderſtand coulde thunder downe vpon v ſpeciall fauour hee doth againe chaſtizeth v offence purpoſe drawe v repentance ſee yee howe miniſtreth many cauſes ſing prayſes vnto yes verelye ſo inaſmuche god ſheweth himſelfe bee good rightuous wyſe well woorde workes wee haue wherefore glorifie haue wee done ſo wee muſt mount yet higher wit muſte glorifie god though hee hide himſelfe v ſhewe himſelfe v neyther rightuouſneſſe goodneſſe anye thing whiche mighte cauſe v ſaye ſayde glory due vnto example vvhen ſcripture ſpeaketh v election hee choozeth whome hee lyketh caſteth awaye reſidue hee diſpoſeth mankinde owne pleaſure likewiſe ſcourgeth good ſeaueth oppreſſed wee ſee thing confounded worlde theſe caces god hydeth himſelfe ſay ſheweth himſelfe vsafter ſuch faſhion reaſon may able take holde rightfulneſſe goodneſſe power wiſedome yet muſt yeeld due glorie thus yee ſee haue marke vpon ſtreyne ſo may well correct beate backe temptation wherof iob ſpeaketh hee ſayeth let god go law mee giue leaue plead againſt boldely ala ſhall wee bee able bring oure matter paſſe haue touched afore iob ment expreſſe tempted repine againſt god wiſe hee reſiſted incounter euen ſo muſt bicauſe haue ſayde alreadie although god ſhoulde giue v ſayde libertie pleading againſt yet ſhould wee confounded iob yll remember bicauſe mind bewrapped ſuch anguiſh wiſt hee ſayd ſo perfect man ſet forth v mirrour pacience ſo incumbred become v much behooueth v marke well ſayde witte god vtter himſelfe v muſt glorifie ſo hide himſelfe wee muſte reuerence ſecretes whiche incomprehenſible v ſo muſte euery way haue mouth ſhut ſay might reaſon matter ſhould preuayle cace wee ſhall ſomtimes ſee ſcripture god ſayth come let v pleade togither according ſayde prophet eſay beholde contented bee iudge betwixt v ſee whither caces beſte ende ſayeth god ſo ſtoppe mouthes wicked folke full rancour agaynſte thought themſelues haue gotten gole men allowed yea ſayeth lorde ende yee alledge vſe tyrannicall power agaynſt yee bee oppreſſed withoute cauſe reaſon come wayes contented muſtered ranke among men bee taken creature forgo mine owne right ſouereine dominion maieſtie mee contented preſent cace ye ſhall haue regard none geere yet yee ſhall bee condemned neuertheleſſe ye ſee god well contented enter account v ſpeaketh ſo agaynſte deſpizers ſpite vtterly rebellious agaynſte thoſe ſhall finde ynough condemne among ſort dooth iob put himſelfe among haue bin deſirous ſerue god haue walked vnder obedience lawe yea verely howbeit hee deceyueth himſelfe much man ſo perfect whome god findeth muche faultineſſe euen ſelfe ſame rule gyueth v law way haue another poynt marke iob ſheweth v howe ſinnes hee committed cauſe god handleth ſo roughly true poynt iob ſo groſſe headed hee knewe well ynough hee ſhould found faulty god life examined lawe iob might know well ynough true greefe caryed away became good blinde howſoeuer world went yet knew well god ſhall euermore find giltineſſe mē vvhy doth ſay ſpeake boldely hee turneth talke thoſe accuſed preſent diſcourſe rather agaynſt men agaynſt matter iob ſpoken without aduerſarie would haue ſayde ala confeſſe ſelfe indetted vnto god although poſsible might quite clere dette according law ſay although able diſcharge duty ful yet ſhould bee fayne make recourſe meere goodneſſe lo iob woulde haue ſpoken foraſmuche layde charge hee ſo puniſhed offence ſake hee beene diſpyzer god hee ſayeth durſte bee bolde pleade reſpect ſaying durſte bee bolde pleade true haue ſayde caried away pafsions howbeit foraſmuche hath eye aduerſarie party hee meeneth none otherwiſe wee haue declared alreadie thus much meening ſtreyne let v conſider howe wee may profite oure ſelues haue tolde heeretofore wee haue done euer god commandeth v whiche impoſsible man doo yet cace ſuche hee ſtill finde ſome meane condemne v yea yet ſhall hee himſelfe continue rightuous vvhat haue wee doo onelye humble oure ſelues furthermore lette v learne knowe god vſeth double goodneſſe towardes v hee giueth v lawe alſo plucketh v damnation wherinto ſame caſteth v yee ſee ſaye one poynte god goodneſſe hee ſpeaketh ſo familiarlie vntoo men ſay go owe nothing bee indetted bounde vnto mee much woorth deale thinke good yet meane ſhall ſay vnto pay v aſmuch yee bee mine good reaſon euer haue ſhould bee dedicated mee neuertheleſſe beare ſo farre bee contented fulfill lawe giue euerlaſting life rewarde notwithſtanding mighte requite youre hande oute recompence seeing god ſpeaketh thus lawe yee ſee greate goodneſſe alreadie rightuouſneſſe whiche hee requireth handes ſuch bee required pure creature ſuche angelles heauen reſpect bee oure owne nature nowe ſinfull corrupted wee muſte alwayes beare well minde ſeeing god hath ſpoken ſo wee ſhoulde v bee confounded damned hee goeth ſetteth mercie v otherewiſe wee ſhoulde abyde accurſed notwithſtanding wee perfourmed thing conteyned lawe howbeeit foraſmuche oure good god holdeth v vp notwithſtanding haue bothe wayes doone amiſſe thing whiche draweth v curſe lawe let v remember god dooth well giue v cauſe come vntoo pleade iuſtifie caſe mouthes muſt bee ſtopped acknowledge ſelues meanes indetted vnto verely euen owne mother wit • e doth v vnderſtande muſt needes bee condemned yea thoughe hee ſpeake one worde yet ynough wee haue ſayde iudgement ingrauen within v ſo v cannot leaſtwiſe ought bee owne iudge owne hypocriſie letted v know owne conſcience muſt ſpyte teeth reproue v lo heere ſpeciall poynt furthermore ſteade vmpers heare matter debated let v ſeeke ieſus chriſt may vmper take vp matter let v deſire haue iudge lay hande vpon v let v beſeech may ſome meanes attonemēt betwene v maieſtie ye ſee god eſtraunged ſeparated v cauſe ſinnes ſayeth prophete eſay god dwelleth v power howe haue wee beeing moouing lyfe howe haue wee continuance reaſon power ſpred throughe thing yet wee ceaſſe bee ſeparated ſinnes iniquity vvhat muſt wee doo vvhat remayneth ieſus chriſt put himſelfe betwixte v ieſus chriſte muſte bee fayne bee oure dayſman paſſe iudgement vppon maieſtie god ſette god barre v bee meane reconcile v vnto god draw v heade knit v ſuch wife vnto god wee may one scripture ſpeaketh herevpon let v learne humble ſelues ſay▪ lord come vnto thee pleade preſume vpon thing v owne perſons bicauſe thou art fauourable v bicauſe thou art willing receyue v thy ſonne ieſus chriſtes ſake thing whereof vaunte ſelues wee muſt continue confounded reſpect ſelues foraſmuch pleaſeth thee make v feele thine infinite goodneſſe thou haſt ſet forth thine onely ſonne lorde ieſus chriſt whome thou gaueſt death ſakes wee nowe doubt thou wilt receyue v notwithſtanding wee bee vnworthie let v fall downe maieſtie good god acknowledgemente innumerable ſinnes ceaſſe commit dayly againſt beſeeching foraſmuche wee bee full filthineſſe infection may pleaſe purge v rid v ſpttes ſpecially correct hypocriſie vnto bee much giuen ende miſliking fault offence haue committed heeretofore may deſire nothing ſomuch returne vnto true repentance aſſuring oure ſelues ſhall fayle get pardon hande leaſtwiſe ſo well come true ſoundneſſe hearte praying moreouer gouerne v ſuche wiſe holy ſpirite although wee bee full many infirmity bee ſo manye wayes defiled yet may pleaſe receyue v vſe rigour extremity towardes v may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c xxxviij sermon first vpon tenth chapter 1 ſoule cut lyfe vvill leaue complaynte vpon ſelfe vvill ſpeake bitterneſſe 2 vvill ſay god condemne mee ſhevve mee vvhy thou pleadeſt agaynſt mee 3 good thee doo mee vvrong caſte avvay vvorke thine ovvne handes cleere deuice vvicked 4 haſt thou eye fleſhe lookeſt thou maner men 5 thy dayes dayes men thy yeares yeares mortall man 6 thou ſhou • deſt ſerche mine iniquitie make inquirie ſinne thing ſpoken iob may well bee ſpoken euery v ſo farrefoorth bee good holy prayer made vnto god allowe firſt wee bee preſſed anguiſh wee may well ſay ſhall get good aduaūcing ourſelues againſt god going lawe secondly may deſire make v feele oure ſinnes cheefe condemnation hee ſhall pronounce vpon v ſhall boote whit oure ſaluation except wee bee touched ouerthrowne ſelues man muſte become owne iudge condemne himſelfe bee quit god hande alſo may well marke ſhewes added immediatly witte reaſon god ſhoulde giue wicked ſhorte occaſion like theyr blaſphemies lewde dealing otherſyde hee earthlye creature hee ſhoulde bee deſyrous reuenge himſelfe finally wee bee woorke handes laſtly may well ſaye hee neede put men racke boulte oute miſdeedes knowne vntoo wee may well vſe woordes reported heere good ſorte wee ſee howe iob vttereth paſsions hee caryed away hee reſiſted haue declared aſore yet gathered meane hee cōbred firſt brunt confeſſeth ſuche bitterneſſe although ſhould gayne nothing yet could ſtrengthen himſelfe complayntes rather giue theyr full ſcope hebrew woorde put ſignifieth bothe leaue let looce alſo fortifie ſtrengthen therefore let v marke well iob ſpeaketh heere man ouerfull paſsions neuertheleſſe hee knoweth nature god reſtreyneth himſelfe neither laboureth make cace good accuſing god contrariwiſe confeſſeth hee amazed witte men ſay therfore reſorteth praying vnto god hee condemne hee ſhoulde ſhewe wherefore hee goeth law bring downe poynt ſhould make perceyue reaſon hee indureth let v go theſe matter woorde woorde ſayeth ſoule cut life hebrew worde ſignifieth oftentimes miſlyke ſhould ſay ſoule wearie life lothe liue longer truer meening ſay ſoule cut life ſo although alyue yet notwithſtanding hee confeſſeth ſtate ſuch euen good deade behold ſayeth lyfe lyfe lyue death thus yee ſee meening ſo hereby hee confeſſeth himſelfe paſt hope yea verely reſpect god handling hee ſtill hope god howbeeit truſte therevnto behoued go owne perſon poynt whiche wee ought marke throughlye wee looke vppon oure preſente ſtate wee doo wee ſhoulde bee vtterlie ouerthrowen proofe heereof althoughe man bee eaſe yet hath hee continuance beare oute inconueniences lyfe hee looke vppon owne frayltie hee beſeeged hundred deathes hee hath ſhadowe lyfe ſpeciallie god ſcourgeth v ſheweth himſelfe oure aduerſarie ſo ſhoulde ſeeme hee thunder vpon v ſo one ſide conſider oure ſinnes ſyde haue eye ſo perfect highe rightuouſneſſe whiche god certayne wee cannot conceyue hope ſaluation oure ſelues notwithſtanding ſuffer themſelues bee ouercome ſuche temptation doo well ſhewe themſelues bee ouerdull ſay haue ſuche feeling god iudgement ought haue whoſoeuer touched rightlye quicke ſhall feele himſelfe hell hee bethinketh ſinnes ſpeciallye god ſummon ſeate make feele howe gyltie hee nought tolde iob confeſſeth himſelfe bee paſte hope yea verely reſpect himſelfe neuerthelater ſo hee taſted god mercie fatherlye loue wherevntoo hee alwayes recourſe thing whereby hee ſuſteyned ouercame ſo greate temptation v alſo like wee haue conſidered oure ſinnes bee ſory wee muſt herken ſweete amyable voyce whereby god calleth v himſelfe promiſeth ſaluation life angel onely ſuch able ſhew themſelues rightuous ſo man • worlde ſhould bee ſhet lyfe ſaluation god declareth fauorable ſinners vtterly caſt downe themſelues ſo know become yee ſee howe ſelues ſelues muſt ſeke comfort whē haue ſorowed ſight ſinnes wee feele ſuch trouble ſee nothing hell open v ſwallow v vp muſt wee lift vp eye aloft looke vpon ineſtimable goodneſſe god whereby hee willing call v ſaluation notwithſtanding wee bee good damned alreadie thus ye ſee haue note vpon firſt place wheras iob ſayeth ſeeing ſo hee take leaue talke himſelfe vpon himſelfe therin declareth meeneth bewray paſsions wherwith turmoyled whiche themſelues euill damnable neuertheleſſe iob intended lay foorth end men might know oppreſſed heauineſſe yea euen ſuch heauineſſe hee ſaw remedie fayne make moane ſo frayle man holye ghoſt yet foreſight ment iob ſhould bee prophet teacher vnto v giue v warning oure affection behoueth men know themſelues warned infirmity may take heede themſelues brydle thēſelues ſomuche let themſelues liberty ſhall keepe neither meane meaſure lo howe wee ought applie leſſon oure inſtruction neuertheleſſe behoueth v marke well ſpeeche iob ſayeth hee take libertie make complayntes agaynſte himſelfe hee ſhoulde ſaye knowe ſhall gayne nothing ſtanding contention god yee ſee preface whiche vſeth importeth profitable leſſon men opinion ſhall diſcharge themſelues well ynoughe maye frette grudge agaynſte god heere yee ſee wherein wicked comforte themſelues beholde wyll ſeeme well eaſed theyr burthen haue ſpewed ſome blaſphemies vttered theyr impatience yet booteth nothing make theyr cace muche woorſe wee haue thing ouerlodeth v well wee caſte grounde wee bee vnburthened true haue greate burthen vpon ſhoulders betwixt myne armes woulde caſte vpon myne heade make greate ſtriuing doo nexte waye breake necke haue gayned euen ſo v wee pleade god one wee woulde hoyſe vp burthen vpon heade muſte needes fall vpon thing wee doo whiche waye ſoeuer wee flee ſhall lyghte vppon v vvee ſee men doo nought deſtroye themſelues vomite ſpewe vp theyr murmuring blaſphemies faſhion agaynſt god thus yee perceyue ſayde leſſon greatly oure profite true god woulde haue v vſe homelineſſe vnburthening ſelues intoo lappe manner proceeding therein verye diuerſe ſayde pſalmes many place holy ſcripture manner wee ſhoulde conſider god prouide foraſmuch office gouerne world well remedie needes giue v releefe ouerfore oppreſſed lo howe wee may lay care greefes god lap take charge whereby ſhall eaſed yea wee come prayer ſupplication haue heauineſſe greefe nippeth v let v ſay well lorde thee ſuccoure thy faithfull ſeruants pyne payne come hither knowing ſhall become thou pitie therefore wee ſhall haue requeſted god ſort ſhall haue yeelded v recorde hath bene deafe deſires ſure hath heard good diſcharge god commeth ſtill v receyueth burthē deliuer vnto thoſe harden themſelues pryde puffed vp caried away impaciencie bend themſelues agaynſt god man would ſhoote arrow heauen ſame muſt needes fall backe vppon owne heade man ſhoulde caſt vp ſtone ſame ſhould light vpon owne pate alſo therfore make complayntes let v well aduiſed ſame done lowlineſſe yea reſt wholly vppon god prouidence grounding ſelues vppon goodneſſe fatherly loue whych hath ſhewed v going vntoo prayer ſupplication ſo ſhall vnburthened god prouide thinke amende cace grudging caſting foorth ſome bitter talke certayne thereby ſhall bring ſelues worſe plight wee afore yee ſee haue conſider vpon text iob confeſſeth giue exceſsiue paſsions head ſame muſt needes rebounde backe vppon himſelfe againſt hymſelfe meane ſeaſon hee declareth hys intent lift vp himſelfe againſt god acknowledge complayntes hee ſhoulde make came greefe hee indured aduerſitie therefore let v acknowledge faultes yet haue acknowledged wee muſte alſo ſeeke remedie wee perceyue oure fleſhe vnable beare affliction god ſendeth v let v runne vntoo hath ſpirit ſtrength yea himſelfe deale abrode ſuche haue neede nowe men knowe infirmity haue doo behold god telleth hee able helpe ſtrengthen seeing wee warned ſo oure diſeaſes go wee phiſition ſeemeth moſte men ſufficient diſcharge ſay true haue ſinned man fleſhe bloude neyther yron ſteele miſfortune happen vnto muſt needes feele true meane whertoo ſerue warninges giuen v holy ſcripture serue ſhewe god warneth v ſinnes hee would haue v bee ſorie euerie v ſhould hate himſelfe ſeeing himſelfe bee ſuch one againe wherto ſerue promiſes alſo hee addeth make v come ſtreyte vntoo praying performe v wee may doubt readye ſuccour v whenſoeuer hee ſeeth v dryuen neceſsitie yee ſee thing haue doo onely acknowledge faultes alſo come vnto god may amende goodneſſe grace holy ſpirite iob ſayth hee crie vnto god ſaying condemne mee ſhew mee wherefore thou pleadest heere iob ſpeaketh ſtill man troubled wittes loth god ſhould proceede ſayde ſecrete hidden rightfulneſſe whereof treated yeſterday woulde haue god examine ordinarie manner ſayde afore god hath giuen v ſure rule lawe intreated according offence beholde god rightuouſneſſe ſet foorth inditement giuen v layd afore v writing inſomuch ſee article proued againſt v yea ſo well proued ſuffize caſt v therfore men ſcourged god hande ſinnes ſee law onely ſentence condemnation alſo whole inditement matter ſo layde foorth poynt poynt fayne caſt heades intoo boſomes howbeit forſomuch god ſcourgeth iob ordinarie manner graunted satan leaue trouble therefore iob ſayth condemne till thou haſt firſt commenced thyne action ſayde bycauſe god ſecret iuſtice ſtraunge v knowe wit cannot attaine therevnto ſo alwayes deſirous knowe reaſon god worketh ſo would haue accountable v whē god ſcourgeth v letteth v know wherfore therevpon amazed angrie ſo god rightuous muſt doth needes ruled reaſon vprightneſſe yes ſee ſo rather flat contrary see men puffed vp pleade againſt god make diſcourſes within themſelues yea euen diſcourſes hartburning ſumiſhneſſe thus yee ſee iob ſeeketh ſentence yet god able ſhewe hym playnly yea ſay make perceyue rightuous ſo euer bene good reaſon ſhould bee chaſtized ſinnes wherfore doth make ſuch proteſtation hee ſeemeth beare men hand caſe good god would chaſtize rule law rather hath reſpect purpoſe god ſhould confeſſe himſelf vnfaynedly ſinner although god good reaſon puniſh ſo greeuouſly yet notwithſtanding hee puniſh ſinnes ſake proofe thereof ſaw many wicked folke world ſpared whyleſt puniſhed owne part always indeuered ſerue god vttermoſt power vvherefore hee ſo ſcourged bycauſe god ſome ſpeciall cō ſideration ye ſee iob pretendeth heere witte obteyne god ſhould handle ordinarie manner ende make perceyue ſinnes heerewithall haue apply thys preſent leſſon owne inſtruction ſtād v great ſtead applying pray god ſhew v wherfore entreth proceſſe againſt v calleth v iudgement without al chaſtizements endure purpoſe according ſee greater part world doo harden ſelues againſt god vvee ſee god ſcourges beate great ſmall deede euery man crieth ala wretched world better adayes meane ſeaſon repentance auaile al theſe chaſtizements ſemeth men haue cōſpired withſtand god beate backe blowes inſomuch god giue neuer ſo great ſtrokes hammer ſee hart ſtythes ſo farre frō ſoftning rather harden vvherof commeth bycauſe want wiſdome diſcretion know god pleadeth againſt v profitable petition v deſire god ſhould ſimply condemne v rather make v vnderſtand wherein guiltie enlighten v holy ſpirit may enter examining oure owne conſciences haue well conſidered ſinnes may mourne haue intent returne vnto yeeld ſelues confounded may haue pitie vpon v lo heere ſpeciall poynt beſides yet another ſecond requeſt god puniſhing v may bee oppreſſe v vtterly wil deale v ſuch ſort wee may haue leyſure bethinke v ſinnes preſent requeſt differeth vvhy ſo god ſhoulde come ſo great headie violēce firſt brunt might vtterly diſmaid wold become v vve ſhuld haue ſtomacke acknowledge ala god iudge yet neuer ceaſſeth father ſtill miſerable offender condemned dulled drawen gallowes like blocke wood vnable receiue comfort though offered euen ſo ye ſee ſame taking god doth ſayd horrible extremitie begin ſhew himſelfe againſt v hand conceiue eternall death whiche ſo comberſome v ouerwhelmeth v ſuche darkneſſe wee haue ſo much one little ſparke good comfort come vnto vve poſſeſſed ſuch fearfulneſſe haue witte ſaye ala god yet giue thou ſpace repentance thy ſilly poore creature preſenteth himſelfe thee therefore wee haue greate neede returne vnto god example iob praying indite v condemne v ſay deale ſo mildly v may haue reſpite bethinke ſelues heere ye ſee ieremy likewiſe ſayth lord chaſtize thou howbeit meaſure ſayth welynough god liſted deale rigorouſly v ſhould vtterly ouerwhelmed paſt recouerie therefore beſeecheth god chaſtize hym meaſure ſay chaſtizement may tempered moderated ſuch wiſe hee may reade quietly examin fault ſorie therevpon may alſo take hart returne vntoo god hope forgiueneſſe hand ye ſee behoueth v neceſſarie v doo ſee god ſcourges continually ſent abrode whole world cauſe miſcheefe ſame whiche haue ſhewed already witte bycauſe men cōſider god ſcourgeth beateth faſhion agayne ſee men beſotted ſuch preſumptuouſneſſe yea ſuch fooliſh rage thinke themſelues alwayes able iuſtifie themſelues god ſeeing pride ſo deepely rooted nature ought ſo much prouoked make ſaid petition haue ſpoken witte god ſhould ſhew v wherefore ſueth againſt v ſay hee ſhould make v feele ſinnes ſuche manner might driuen willingly confeſſe ſelues guiltie afterward bee taught returne vntoo yet whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god ſhew men wherefore hee pleadeth againſt man hath enditement throughly framed already euen rightuouſeſt man vppon earth ſay euen according rule lawe ſo god needeth bring v high iuſtice incomprehenſible v looke vppon owne life one ſide otherſide conſidering god law requireth comparing work rule god hath lent v ſhall bee driuen vtter confuſion vvherefore mē preſume ſo much vpon work vpon theyr vertues vpon merites▪ bycauſe neuer knew god iuſtice whereof commeth thys hypocriſie popedome men ſhall preache free merit ſatiſfactions ſet vp briſtles ſuche wiſe beare themſelues hande may come perking god yea preace thither lyke ſhameleſſe ſtrumpets full filth vncleanneſſe yet notwithſtanding preache theyr owne merites beare themſelues hand haue done amiſſe well quit themſelues againe ſatiſfactions whereof commeth ſuch pride bycauſe neuer rightly cited ſayd iudgement ſeate feele guiltie therefore lette v marke well wee deſire god ſhewe v wherefore hee pleadeth againſt vs▪ iuſtifying quitting ſelues muſt bee marke wee muſt ſhoote rather muſt yeeld ourſelues giltie may receyued mercie behold onely remedie left v deſire god pitie v bycauſe wee part bring nothing owne confuſion thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreine way iob addeth good thee wrong cast away worke thy handes make determination wicked ſhine pleaſure thee priuie coūſell wicked heere iob ſpeaketh nature god euen intēt obtayn requeſt haue touched heretofore god ſuffereth v vſe ſuche manner ſpeeche come vnto witte hee giueth v leaue ſpeake familiarly neuertheleſſe muſte bee done lowlineſſe god ſo freendlie abace ſelfe intent wee ſhould alledge ſet farre giue v boldneſſe ouerſhoote ourſelues ſo ſhould come ſcornefully diſdayne end ſorrow ſhould ouerwhelme v ſuche ſort ſhould able take breath bee hope god wil regard v thus ye ſee meane wee haue find ſome eaſement ſhall ſeeme wee vtterly vndone reſpect ſelues ceaſſe lay open oure hart ſo familiarly vntoo god make moane vnto little child get father ſeeing giueth v leane ſo ye ſee faith god childrē may well ſtabliſhed pride ouerweening true lowlineſſe let v come iob ſayeth shalt thou gayne thing mee wrong casting away worke thy hand goddes righteouſneſſe tried like men led affection vvhereof commeth men wrong harme ſome anoyance guile malice neighboure bycauſe profiteth ſelues vvherefore iudge bribed vvherfore hee oppreſſe good men ſupport wicked men vvill led credite fauoure bycauſe ſeemeth profit win good ſome perſon elſe auēge ſelf none theſe thing faſten vpon god vve ſee righteouſneſſe proued one parte god ſcourgeth men doth hee bend ſelfe againſt enemy no▪ hee addreſſeth ſelfe creature worke hand hath created faſhioned v vvil deſtroy hath made therefore behoueth v conclude god cannot vſe eyther wrong crueltie towardes v cannot vſe wrong verely bycauſe requireth thing men hand due conuicted thereof although malicious ſtubborne yet haue alwayes ſome reſpect vnto true ſome ſo ouerbold naughtineſſe giue themſelues ſo wholly vnto thinke vpon god notwithſtanding haue ſaid euen nature imprinteth alwayes vnderſtanding men know commoditie profite extorcion wrong neighbour men euill themſelues euill owne profite god fountayne goodneſſe rule righte bee moued v harme puniſhe v wrongfullye without hauing profite wee ſee heere one proofe god righteouſneſſe agayne manifeſt vſe crueltie againſt v workemanſhip inaſmuch hath faſhioned v certayne therefore forſomuch workmanſhip deſtroy v without cauſe vve ſee workman hath made peece worke wold haue fame preſerued ſtill god hath put v thys world record power righteouſneſſe goodneſſe wiſdome vvill hee deſtroy v without cauſe doctrine greatly behoofe ſo able applye well inſtruction yea satan tempt v aſſayes offended god ſhould ſay vſed ouergreat rigoure towardes v hee vnrighteous muſt haue ſtay ſay wretched creature againſt whome bendeſt thou thy ſelfe imagineſt thou thy god doth thee wrong poſsible hym thou art full ſinne thou art full malice craftineſſe deceit yet notwithſtanding thou haſt eye thine owne profite whē thou doſt man harme thou anoy impeach man thy ſelfe another man loſſe hindrance thy god gayne thing thee vvilt thou make copartner thine vnrighteouſneſſe ſinne conſider thus farre certayne ſhall horribly afrayde treate ſort god righteouſneſſe meanes bring queſtion furthermore conſider ſelues ſay god hath ſet thee world hath ſpred graciouſe gift great treaſures goodneſſe vppon thee whiche thou marke thy body thou ſhalte haue matter ynough rauiſh thee wondering muſt thou needes bee vnſenſible yea poſſeſſed diuell thou ſhalt charge thy god crueltie hath ſhewed ſelfe ſo gentle louing towards thee yee ſee howe wee muſt practize leſſon may haue skill profite ourſelues ſaying added yet practized nothing rife v pacience wee ſee wicked deſpizers god ruffe though world make triumphes skorning god goſpell v profeſſe god afflicteth church ye ſee wicked ſuch triumph thinke haue wonne goale ſeemeth god fauoreth afterward ther commeth ſome trouble thing go cleane backward whereas ought confirmed number faithfull ſhall increase whereas ought ſtrēgthned faith al goodneſſe ſee many whiche made pretence beleeue goſpel ſlip head coller become muche wicked outrageous open enemy vve ſee thing alſo whereof hope ſhall amēd better greeueth v ſay god ſuffereth geere ſeemeth minded aduaunce wicked heere hee willing open theyr mouthes may ſpew blaſphemies againſt hym ſeemeth altogither agaynſte v pleaſure haue v vexed made laughingſtocke men wil god ſo cleere deuiſes wicked vvill hee take part bee partner corruption filthineſſe lo geere may runne oure head much therefore behoueth v fenced againſt ſuch temptation according iob ſetteth downe twayne thys ſentence one ſide hee confeſſeth came thus hys imagination ſeemeth god taketh wicked mennes part hath made compact giue ſo much boldneſſe iob confeſſeth thys temptation came head howbeit withſtoode confeſſeth impoſsible god ſhoulde vtterly againſt euill bycauſe naturally hateth otherwiſe ſhould fayne denye himſelfe forſomuch god iudge worlde hee muſte needes hate vnrightuouſneſſe vvherefore let v aſſure ſelues neuer cleere intent wicked ſay neuer ſhewe himſelfe allow vvhat exerciſe pacience meane therefore let v armed againſt ſtumblingblocks vvhen wee ſee wicked enemy truth take occaſion skoffe god v reaſon thing ſo confounded world let v ſay well yet god ſide end muſt confoūded pride behoueth v looke behold tyme darkneſſe lorde ieſus chriſt termeth ciuell hath ſuch libertie miſcheefe wicked haue reynes bridle looce theyr necke ſayeth kingdome reigne darkneſſe thing confounded dark god wil chace away darkneſſe gyue v light length according haue moſt certayne promis let v tary quiet conclude impoſsible god ſhoulde fauour deuiſes wicked howſoeuer hee ſeeme diſſemble matter meane towards v therefore muſt bee pacient end time conuenient ſhewe v wee haue bene deceyued wayting leyſure lo haue note concerning text touching iob addeth wit whither god haue ſuch eye man hath elſe whither tyme bee tyme mortall man ſhewe god needeth make long inqueſts againſt v hee ſhould ſay lord thou knoweſt thing yea preſent thee creation worlde therefore thou needeſt vſe ordinarie courſe earthly iudges make long proceſſes whyle hold offender vpon racke ſo bycauſe ignorance thou haſte neede wherefore handleſt thou ſo rigorouſly iob ſpeaketh well god nature hee concludeth ill bewrayeth exceſsiue paſsion ſayd afore cheefe point ſhould conſider apply leſſon owne vſe vvhereas iob deſyreth eaſed bycauſe god hath eye mortall man let v vnderſtand god ſcourgeth v doeth boult certaintie aught vnknowen concealed make v vnderſtād vvhy doth god ſuffer v pine away proceſſe time ſeing make cleane riddance v • firſt blowe doth end ſhould bethinke ſelues better heere iob contrary hymſelfe vvherein ſee mennes paſsions ſo diuers oftentimes ſpeake againſt themſelues euē ſee waues ſea breake one another violence euen ſo paſsions contrary repugnant one againſt another v vve ſee awhit would ſhore vp eye ſhoulde find ſuche contrariouſneſſe ſelues wee ſpeake one one thing another another behold happened vnto iob ſayd euen condemne ſhewe wherefore thou ſeweſt vvell god ment ſhew ſide knew howbeit ſayeth hee preſſed ouerfore hee pacience continually haue ſayd ſame ſo perfect requiſite whenſoeuer oft ſhal happen ſmitten god hand ſoone ſcaped one wo wee enter another ſo wee continue lingering paine ſee end miſeries thinke plucke one foote myre ſinketh let v aknowledge god afflicteth v bycauſe hee taketh pleaſure profit aduauntage bycauſe draw v meane ſo let ſame make v thinke thoſe affliction ſweete amiable ſeeing wee perceyue tend ſaluation welfare wiſe let v hart ſcourgeth v diuers way hath giuen v one ſtripe turne agayne ſtrike v twyce thrice let v ſay well lord ſeing pleaſeth thee hold v vpon racke ſuffer v rooted naughtineſſe ſhoulde grind teethe againſt thee though conuicted ſinnes make v come right meekeneſſe ſue thy mercie may find thee fauorable pitifull towards v behold ſay ought bycauſe haue none acceſſe god lorde ieſus chriſt let v repayre vnto praying put v ſuch redineſſe may receyued hande although muſt fayne indure many trouble miſeries preſent life yet beare paciently let v doubt ſhall turne welfare ſerue v ſted ſalues mediciues let v preſent ſelues maieſtie good god aknowledging innumerable fault giltie ſight praying hath made v perceiue alſo withdrawe v thē ſo gouerne v holy ſpirit may fight ſuch wiſe againſt temptation fleſh world haue ouercome may come triumph glory prepared v heauen ſo let v ſay almghtie god c xxxix sermon ſecond vpon tenth chapter 7 thou knovveſt cannot vvickedly man deliuer thy hande 8 thy handes haue made mee haue faſhyoned vvholly round dooſt thou deſtroy 9 remember thou haſte made clay thou ſhalt bring mee duſt agayne 10 haſte thou poured like milke haſt thou ſet mee togither like cheeſe 11 haſte thou clothed mee vvith skin fleſhe knit mee togither vvith bone ſinevves 12 thou haſt giuen life grace thy viſitation hath preſerued soule 13 theſe thinges haſte thou hidden thee yet notvvithſtanding knovve ſo vvith thee 14 haue ſinned thou vvilt impriſon mee thou vvilt ſuffer ſcape vnpuniſhed 15 haue done miſſe vvo mee haue bin righteouſe yet ſhall lift vp head ſeeing filled vvith ſhame knovving mine affliction iob going forwarde whyche declared yeſterday telleth god heere hee needeth make inquiſition manner earthly iudges vvhy ſo thou knowest ſaith euill man deliuer thy band men haue offender warde afrayd leaſt ſhould worſe hee done afore eſcape ſpecially laboure reuenge themſelues paſt cauſe men fayne kill thoſe whome hope amendment afterwarde iob ſayeth ſo god vvherefore thou knoweſt ſayeth euill thou knoweſt although thou deliuer puniſhmente alwayes ſubiect thee whenſoeuer pleaſeth thee thou canſt bring agayne wretched plight wherein seeing ſo ſhould prouoke thee put mee ſo many torment haue ſayd already theſe requeſts may well made vnto god ſo al lowlineſſe ſtand contention though wee wold blame handling v rigorouſly elſe alledge ſome reaſon owne behalfe iuſtifie oure cace withall vvhen come manner ſettled purpoſe mind ſay ala lord reſpect thy ſelfe know thou proceedeſt maner men ſhould leade thee ſo thou knoweſt thou knoweſt hearte againe thine owne power bridle though wickeddeſt caitif world yet coulde eſcape ſhall gayne ſtriuing againſt thee duſt poore mortall creature lo heere ſpeciall poynt moreouer thou blowe vpon ſhall right nought al lord know therefore conclude thou art led fleſhly affection thou ſcourgeſt vvhat remayneth make feele thy goodneſſe vvhen bee well aſſured god rightfulneſſe therewithal haue full purpoſe incline ſelues ſtedfaſt truſt let v imagin heareth v ſhewe v mercie thus ye ſee wee may vſe iobs talke hath ſayd ſo addeth thy hand haue made haue faſhioned wholly round aboute yet wilt thou deſtroy heere returneth declared yeſterday matter hath bin touched afore nowe confirmeth new againe without cauſe matter ought comfort v greatly god vſe rigoure towards v doth crueltie vvhy ſo hath regard owne worke thing made therefore oft god ſtriketh v wee muſt alwayes thinke thus vvel made ſelfe god lifteth ſelfe vp againſt ſtraunge thing worke owne hand ſith ſo becommeth ſay hee hath good reaſon deale thus cruell certaine acknowledgeth owne worke god doth man might ſay loke vpon ſelfe behold ſelfe men glaſſe without cauſe looked vpon made found good man principall worke excellenteſt creature hys vtter thing put ſmall portion heauen earth liuing wight ſomuch man termed little worlde wherein ſee ſo many wonderfull thing man muſt needes aſtonied sith ſo wee muſt alwayes beleeue god beholding hys owne woorkmanſhip v moued inclined doo v good mainteyne v know attributed holy ſcripture namely hee preſerueth hath made bringeth thyng perfection hath begonne ſeeing cace ſo hee hath vſed ſo ſingular fauoure towards v doubt continue ſame end ſee matter ſay conſidering god made v ought ſtand v great ſtead wee applye good vſe heere yee ſee alſo iob maketh larger diſcourſe verſe ſaith lord wilt thou deuoure ſo ſignifieth hebrew word tranſlate wilte thou destroy ſeeing thou hast faſhioned wholly round hee meeneth fault bee found one may well make goodly peece worke ſhall ſo perfectly poliſhed alike throughout ſome part wherein hath vſed like cunning man make peece fayre tapiſtrie ther ſhall outſide bewtifull eye ſight ſhal altogither il fauored man ſee hee poliſhed top toe ſo ther one orderly workmanſhip thoroughout yea according order nature ther exception taken euen tippes nayles iob therfore ment expreſſe infinite wiſdome god vttereth ſelfe ſhape man ſayde lord wilt thou deſtroy ſo excellent work wherein man may ſee thy wiſdome thy power ineſtimable goodneſſe thy glory vvilt thou take pleaſure ſo defacing thine owne glory appeereth ſhineth men ſee meening howbeit hee addeth haue touched witte god hath made clay ſhall bring dust agayne ſhould ſay lord thy workmanſhip taken ſhould remaine beginning mire earth true none adam god made earth heereby yeſee whence haue firſte beginning vve muſt v come backe thither vvhē bethinke v whence men come whereof made wit earth let v aſſure ourſelues ſame verified vpon v al general ſeing god hath made v earth let take away hath put v ſay let hym withdraw power wiſdome goodneſſe whiche hee hath ſhed vppon v wee muſt needes retourne whence wee came cace ſtanding doth god deſtroy v much deface owne glory yes without reaſon deſtroyeth wicked vnrighteouſe bycauſe much could haue blotted image printed nature deede moyſes declareth god ſorie ſaw men corrupted faſhion behold ſayth god repented euer made man chaungeableneſſe god repent well foreſeene al thing world made moyſes ſheweth god miſliketh men bee ſo peruerted turned away ſoundneſſe rightuouſneſſe whiche hee put heereby ſee god doeth alwayes acknowledge workmanſhip men howbeit therewithall hee doeth alwayes vtterly miſlike ſinne proceedeth cābe fathered vpon iob addeth hast thou powred like milke heere hee ſpeaketh mannes begetting whiche wonderfull thing whereat oure wittes confounded ſay mannes ſeede ſhoulde ingender liuing wight wight ſo poliſhed ſhoulde appeere ſuche orderly diſpoſition might rauiſh men mynds make aſtoniſhed ought god magnified therein difference betweene originall man making cheeze wee ſee milke ſet togither curded folke make cheeze ſay liuing creature creature beareth image god creature ſo well framed ſhall proceede groundworke begetting men forſomuch ſeemeth bee likelyhode man ſhould bee formed mannes • eede ſo much ſeene god intent glorified therein therefore let v bee rauiſhed ſay lord workman art thou men ſhould compacted ſuch manner dung filthineſſe yet notwithſtanding become ſo excellent thing wee looke vppon man wee muſte needes abaſſhed whither whereof commeth ſhamefull thing ſuche one men loth ſpeake ye ſee god hath ſo abaced v begetting hee haue power ryghtuouſneſſe wiſdome better knowne thereby lo iob hath vttered heere ſame cauſe addeth lord thou haſt clothed fleſh skin theſe thing proceede mannes ſeede nothyng infection filthineſſe yet notwithſtanding behold skin behold fleſh beholde ſinewes come thereof whych thing whereat world may amazed seeyng god hath packed ſo many miracle togither one body ſheweth v ſo faire liuely image maieſtie haue wee cauſe ſay lord heere thing farre paſſe witte reaſon iob hath ſpoken man begetting addeth well thou hast giuen mee life grace thy viſitation hath preſerued soule heerein ſheweth god thought ynough haue faſhioned mother womb haue gyuen ſo excellent ſhape beſides ſayeth thou haſt giuen life grace thys word lyfe meeneth liuelineſſe power soule body ſelfe hath mouing dead thing thou therefore ô lord haſt quickened ſaye▪ ſhape body cheefe thing ought magnified thy worke true euen mā may ſee thy woonderfull power wiſdome soule yet paſſeth heerewithall soule hath common life ſuche brute beaſts whoſe ſoule hath power feele mouse eate drinke go come theſe outwards ſenſes man alſo reaſon vnderſtanding truth ſee number thing mind man doeth comprehend lo iob matcheth word life worde grace meening thereby brute beaſts parttakers life men men dignitie farre greater much value ſucceſsiuely declareth god continuer thereof thy viſitation ſayeth thy looking hath preſerued ſoule god hath ſet v good ſtate yet continue vnleſſe haue hand alwayes reached ouer v vvhat done wee may continue ſtate wherein ſtabliſhed god muſt faine breath power intoo v without ceaſsing continually hand v thus ye ſee iob vſeth thys woord viſitation looking ſhould ſay lord thou lookeſt vpon mee fatherly eye certayne ſhoulde vndoone euery minute houre thou lookeſt mee continually thou knoweſt needes thou prouideſt lo preſerued maynteyned end hee addeth although theſe thing hidden thee thou keepest thyne owne minde yet know well ſo thee iob ſhould ſay lord knowe theſe thing ſo hygh cannot reach yet notwithſtanding needes muſt haue ſome ame knowe ſo thee ſay haue ſo perfect knowledge requiſite yet neuertheleſſe knowe ſo haue ſome taſte part whiche ſuffizeth make conclude thou haſte layde foorthe ſo greate treaſures thy wiſdome goodneſſe power mee impoſſible mee value eſteeme deſerue ſee thou handleſt mee vnhappie thou haſte ſhet mee heere prizon ſhall neuer able get ſo looke vppon trouble wherein thou haſte ſet bycauſe ſee end behold ſo abaſhed although rightuouſe yet durſt looke vp excuze ſelfe thee vtterly barred plea▪ like iudge admit allegation barreth partie plea muſt partie need condemned notwithſtanding replication euen ſo mee ſayeth iob ſee although perceyue ſelfe faultie yet notwithſtanding thou haſt puniſhed greeuouſly ſpoken reſpect exceſsiue hartgreefe whereof haue treated yet neuertheleſſe acknowledgeth therewithal ſhould come ſayd rightfulneſſe god incomprehenſible vnto v woulde thinke ſtraunge handled ſo true hee could conceyue thing owne natural vnderſtanding yet neuertheleſſe ſhall haue conſidered thing well hee muſt needes reſiſt ſayde temptation yee ſee effect touched wee haue conſider beare minde iob declareth heere concerning creation men concerning god grace whereby mainteyned ſtate marke ſpeciall poynt hee ſayeth god hath created v clay muſt • e brought dust agayne ſhall haue withdrawen grace ſpred vpon v muſte teach v lowelineſſe wee ſee men ſet muche themſelues euery one v could find hart aduanced aboue cloudes vvhy ſo knowes ſelfe well ſetteth little himſelfe men deſyre purchace eſtimation ſhet eye forget themſelues paſſe conſider bee ſtate wonder ſhould loue ſo well beguile ourſelues yet ſo neuertheleſſe muche muſt wee marke leſſon bringeth v backe point wee woulde come good will▪ witte knowing god tooke v myre dirt behold let men go vaunt themſelues ſay haue ſome worthineſſe vertue yet muſt faine end knowe dirt myre wil ſerue make v itoupe muſt returne ſame ſtate againe god leaue v hope reſurrection ſpeake owne nature ſay euer woorthy bee made account body building mud haue liuelineſſe v nowe ſoothly greenneſſe graſſe prophet eſay ſayeth vve floriſh awhyle floriſhing fadeth hand looke order nature death diſpatcheth euer worthineſſe men ſo much returneth myre dirt earth sith cace ſtandeth ſo let v learne record leſſon▪ oftentymes may ſhrinke horne puffed vp vayne ouerweening moſt men take ſelues bee beholden vnto god wee haue hold hym doo homage without lifting ourſelues vp againſt wee ſhould bewray villanouſe vnthankfulneſſe v ſhould take vpon v honour belongs god vſurp thing wherein haue part let v fully reſolued namely know whence came whither wee muſt returne thing meetly common ſelfe howbeit foraſmuch practize ſo ſlightly therefore holy ſcripture ſpeaketh often furthermore parte alſo let v learne conſider god infinite goodneſſe towards v better haue done bycauſe ſo defyled looke vpon metall men made vpon ſhape giuē compare one ſame giue greater gloſſe whiche god hath put god made v ſubſtance sunne starres made ſome heauenly ſubſtance take men truly wee might haue cauſe ſay beginning honorable thereby grace god ſhould alſo ſomewhat diſgraced mē bethinke dirt myre regard behold thing importeth reproche men ſcarſe vouchſafe caſt eye vpon myre wee haue dirt hanging v yea euen vpon hem garment wee defyled haue hand cannot abide haue face miſlikes v worſt yet wholly clay vve haue ſo much one rag garment heele hoze peece ſhoeſoles clay wee nothing elſe dirt myre within without yet notwithſtanding come conſidering wonderfull woorkmanſhip god hath put intoo v haue ſayd already therein haue occaſion acknowledge god goodneſſe power▪ wiſdome ſo much better cleerelyer ye ſee whē men behold whence came ought caſt head vtterly abace themſelues againe conſidering ſtate degree honoure god hath aduaunced ought rauiſhed vntoo wondering magnifying god acknowledging themſelues ſo muche bounde hauing taken ſo baſe deſpyzed kind matter hath notwithſtanding put intoo ſo preciouſe hygh noble grace force euen ſpyte teethe muſte needes confeſſe behold god vttereth himſelfe full ſo oft think vpon ſelues let theſe two thing come remembraunce namely matter made ſame may rid v pride bereeue v loftineſſe alſo woorkmanſhip god hath put v end may better know much beholden indetted lette euery v crye ala lord wee bee able comprehend hundredth part benefit thou beſtoweſt vpon v thus ye ſee haue remember firſt place herevpon behoueth v alſo conſider iob addeth ſayeth▪ thou hast poured like milke thou haſt faſhioned like cheeſe ſetting togither thou hast clothed skinne bone truely phraze ſpeeche ſeemeth ſomewhat ſtraunge firſt bluſh ſo holy ghoſt fitter thing ſay better kind ſpeech expreſſe begetting men theſe thinges ſeeme anſwerable agreeable maieſtie god nought iob ſpeaketh ſo haue ſayde heeretofore men muſt abaſed neuer ſo loth elſe would alwayes ſo puffed vp pryde could neuer come cō ſideration whiche notwithſtanding needefull thinke god hath put intoo v would become v ſhould withdraw grace quite ſeparate himſelfe v men neuer come ſo farre force therefore behoueth v bee brought myre dirt ſpoken heere true ſuttle ſay weene themſelues wiſe owne brayne wyll take exception heere manner ſpeech ſeeming ſuch would haue wiſhed ye aske philoſophers wil ſpeake another faſhion god knew could edifie v beſt matter ſtandeth vppon diſputing ſuttle ſcholepoynts vpon making v philoſophers vppon lerning much bound vnto god vpon exercyſing ſelues two pointes haue touched one ſide wee ſhould bee aſhamed ſelues owne abaſſhed beholding owne nature ſide ſhould bee rauiſhed knowledge god goodneſſe grace making v ſuche wee bee ſo goodly excellent woorkmanſhip ſay thing wherevnto behoueth v apply indeuer curious inquiring peecemeale cauſes reaſons meanes begetting men wit attayne verely philoſophers diſputed theſe thing ſayd god working begetting men muſt needes extraordinarie apparant reaſon ſhould take ſo perfect excellent worke man body thing ſo bace ſelfe although philoſophers ſay well mā haue thing nature muſt begin corruptiō yet notwithſtanding ye ſee fayre beginning cleane contrary mannes reaſon true god ſhewe euen wiſeſt ſhal graueled come beholding work neuertheleſſe god graunteth philoſophers meane vewe conſider many thing ſhal vnderſtood common people vnlearned ſort god meening call v ſuch ſchoole vvhat ment ſhewe thing auaylable ſaluation ſhuld firſt know ſelues mettal made ſecondly reſpect workmanſhip v wee ſhoulde behold ſhape god hath giuen v glorifie withall end none v nother great ſmall learned ignorant ſimple ſhould haue excuſe god treated thing ouercunningly great clearks would haue ſurmiſed atteyned ſuche knowledge owne ſtudy reaſon greate diſcretion aboue men god ſetteth downe thing heere ſuch ſenſe needeth deſcanting vppon afterward ſuch great ſpeculation vnlearned myght ſay neuer went ſchoole needeth greate learning skill vnderſtand ſayde heere yee ſee greate clearks ſhall blame worthy perceyue thing ignoranteſt perſons ought knowe alſo haue gone ſchole ſhal haue excuſe cloke themſelues withall bycauſe thing god ſetteth downe ought knowne v thus ye ſee ought inure ourſelues ſpeech whiche holy ghoſte vſeth heere mouth iob ſayeth god hath clothed man skin fleſh knit togither bone ſinewes ſerueth expreſſe better hath bene ſayd afore wit difference betwene ſeede man ſee mannes body ye ſee ſeede filth corruption ye ſee fleſh liuely ye ſee skin ſinewes bone let v conſider little manner workmanſhip men skinnes heathen forced ſay ſuche knew ſoueraine godhead might conuicted thereof euen one nayle man without going ye ſee nayles ſuperfluouſe body yet notwithſtanding wee looke well vppon nayles ſhall ſee wonderfull workmanſhip ſerue arme finger may put worke hold whatſoeuer neceſſary bowing finger therefore certayne mannes nayle ſuperfluitie lookingglaſſe god prouidence v ſo ſame wee may perceyue hath wrought ſuche wiſe v vnpoſsible v knowe hundredth part woorkmanſhip hee hath put v ye ſee vttered namelye greate oddes betweene ſeede whereof men begotten thing ſeene mannes body yet cheefe thing soule cauſe hee ſayeth thou haste clothed mee hereby iob meeneth cheefe part men conſiſteth ſhape ſeene eye dwelleth within importeth manner ſpeeche ment ſaying thou haste clothed mee muſt needes ſome gueſt lodged bodie gueſt soule vvee ſee cheefe part men soule god hath put ſo excellent woorkmanſhip body wee muſt need aſtonied thought ſurmounteth farre higher muche greater woorthineſſe beholde degree whiche wee haue remember although manner ſpeeche whereby god meant teache verieſt idiot bee rude groſſe yet notwithſtanding ſee thing ſtill able moue v throughly ſet whole mynd vppon though ſharpeſtwitted fineſtheaded worlde yet iob expreſſeth excellencie woorthineſſe soule ſayeth thou haste giuen mee life grace thy viſitation hath preſerued soule vvhen hee ſayeth thou haſte gyuen mee life ſheweth body nothing though haue ſo goodly wonderfull woorkmanſhip liuelineſſe ſhed forſomuch god hath quickened v therin hath vttered great goodneſſe ought glorifie therein acknowledge ourſelues bound vnto beyond meaſure true wee haue muche v common life ſame mouing much ſelfe let v behold brute beaſtes great matter ſay beholde beaſte ſhall come ſeede ſaye corruption although haue man meane euen touching bodie yet hathe god put mouingneſſe vvee ſee nouriſhment beaſtes haue eaten graſſe ſame turneth bloud milke fleſhe afterward beaſtes bee killed feede v likewiſe vvhen behold theſe thing euen verie beaſtlife man may terme beare witneſſe god moſt excellent power wiſedome much men life cauſe iob ſayeth expreſly god giuen life grace heereby doth v wit life men matched vnderſtanding reaſon therefore ſaide firſt chapter saint iohn life lighte men vvhen iohn declareth thinges quickened worde god ſayde externall wiſedome whiche god welſpring life power hee ſheweth men haue onely life ſo eate drinke ſayeth hee alſo light ſhining worde light hee meeneth image god imprinted v bycauſe wee haue vnderſtanding reaſon bycauſe wee diſcerne betweene good euill bycauſe men borne haue ſome order common ſocietie amōg themſelues ſo euerie man hath conſcience tell euill good yee ſee howe god hath graunted men prerogatiue whiche onely hee hath giuen life alſo inlightned myndes ſuch wiſe iudge diſcerne yea take holde eternall life wee conſider well men certeine wee ſhall wonder nothing whereat ſhall aſtonied reaſon god hath put v ye ſee man heare thing neuer ſawe hee conceiueth mynd vvhen men looke aforehand vnto thinges come compare wyth thing paſt commit vnto memorie againe anye thing read reported alſo iudge thus ſee god hath indued men grace bee valewed ſufficiently therefore let v learne conſider well god hath giuen v ſhall haue cauſe ynough glorifie yea wee ſhall neede paſſe ſelues heere alſo yee ſee saint paule goodly sermon hee made citie athens ſayth men neede go farre learne knowe god ſayth hee haue life mouing wee blinde let v fall groping grope handes poore blinde man doth darke although ſee nothing yet gropeth thereafter taketh way therefore wee bee blinde ſayth saint paule yet may wee grope god workes much hath giuen v wit reaſon ſo wee bee vtterly vnexcuſable wee make grace auailable mention made heere concluſion wee muſt alſo marke well howe iob ſayeth heere thy viſstation ô lord hath preſerued soule hitherto hee hath ſpoken whiche wee may ſee creation begetting vvhen v begotten doth myre ſhewe ſelf ſay full infection filthineſſe therewithall appeereth alſo ſayde workmanſhip god hath put reſpecte body ſoule god preſerued v wee ſhould needes periſhe euerie minute houre ſayde pſalme lorde thou ſendeſt forth thy spirit thing renewed thou withdraweſt thinges goe wrecke decay god muſt bee ſayne mainteine v looke vnto v bee alwayes hande v otherwyſe vtterly vndoone beholde heere poynt well worth weying namely viſitation god looking ſoules ſoules ſpoken preciſely name vvhy ſo ſayde lord thy viſitation preſerueth body bodye ſhall goe graue firſt brunt ſo euen bicauſe thou mainteineſt thy power beene ſayd bene muche farre without compariſon iob ſpeaketh soule ſeemeth vnto v ſoule hath ſelf power quicken body giue liuelyneſſe partly true behoueth v vnderſtand moreouer ſoules immortall power nother life incloſed themſelues though roote vvhere life thē god farre forth god putteth drop ſparke life mennes ſoules ſo farre forth haue liuelyneſſe otherwiſe thus yee ſee wee haue marke vpon ſtreyne ſpecially let v hearken holie ghoſte meant expreſſe worde viſitation god mainteineth v continually looketh v preſerue v elſe ſhould goe wrecke philoſophers well ſay god hathe created faſhyoned v wee haue beeing therewithall opinion god hath ſet v race euery man guydeth gouerneth himſelfe lo howe deface goodneſſe power god vntoo ſame loudneſſe men inclyned muche ſtandeth v hande marke well word viſitation importeth much ſaye god hath put v worlde hee letteth v alone ſhould ſay walke yee euery one ye abideth v continually hath hande alwayes ſtretched breathe power v intent ſhould miſcarie therefore ſeeing wee continue except haue eye alwayes vpon v viſite v loke v wee muſte learne rule life ſuch wyſe euermore preſence much ſame aſſureth v god infinite goodneſſe whiche hee ſheweth towardes v let make v walke feare magnifie yeelde due praiſe nowe let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceiue better wee may ſorie ſo greeued wee alwayes ſeeke remedie reforming thē holie ſpirite like hath created v mortall men ſo make v member lord ieſus chriſt may repayred image loke hee hathe put v nature hee hath put v grace whiche ſurmounteth ſpecially ſeeing hath voutſaued make v new creature inherite heauenly kingdome let v beſeech onely continue good hath begonne v alſo increaſe ſame till bee come full perfection meane time beare infirmity although guiltie yet condemne v rigoure recciue v childrē accordingly hath voutſaued adopte v name meane oure lorde ieſus chriſt may pleaſe c xl sermon third vpon tenth chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon xiiij xv verſes vpon falloweth 16 let increaſe come thou lyon ſhevve thy ſelfe maruelous vpon mee 17 thou renevveſt thy plague againſte mee thy vvrath increaſeth mee ſvvoorde chaunge multitude vpon mee yeſterday ſawe god preſerueth v ſtate wherin hathe ſet v ynough haue created v firſt haue giuen v liuelineſſe hee muſt fayne continue alſo acknowledged reſpecte preſent life much reaſon god ſhould bee prayſed renewing v infinite goodneſſe repayring image v leading v hande vntill ſuch time haue finiſhed courſe behoueth worke greater power behalfe order nature therefore let v learne magnifie god gracio u giftes ſuch wiſe perceiue let v marke well iob hauing felt god beſtowed ſo many benefites vpon ceaſſed ſo greeued fayne bewraye exceſsiue paſsions ſame may muche befall v wee ſhall haue mynded god goodneſſe becommeth v gracious giftes dealeth v dayly haue declared heretofore true remedie aſſuage miſeries feele howe bountifull god vnto v rich goodneſſe poureth vpon v know throughly ynough remedie temptation ſuch ſort may able take courage call vpon euen wee ſhall bee hell well iob knowe theſe thing howe bee affliction ſo great terrible ouermaſtered therefore let v bethinke ourſelues well let v marke god puniſh v vnthankfulneſſe make accoūt benefit dayly beſtoweth vpon v ſhall neede great tribulation ouerthrow v ſhall bee diſpatched hande ſoone feele little aduerſitie proofe let v come iob addeth haue ſinned ſayth hee thou wilt impriſon thou wilt let goe vnpuniſhed ſhould ſaye lorde thou holdeſt mee vpon • acke hee matcheth impriſonment againſt ſome ſodaine puniſhment god myght lay vpon ſhould bee eaſier abyde leaſtwiſe owne ſeeming vvee knowe preſent harmes greeuouſeſt beare hee indureth bitter colde could finde heart bee broyled heate hote deſireth extreme colde iob preſſed ſuche violence hande god ſeemed bee hope recouerie would fayne god ſhould haue killed hand might haue pyned longer like wretched offender condemned ſeeth cannot eſcape yet let alone vnexecuted miſeries encreaſed hee feareth bee put torture hee ſhall charged newe matter day day iob beeing ſuch cace complayneth god perſecuteth ſayth hee ought take oute worlde without anye adoo heereby wee admoniſhed god moderate roddes hee myndeth chaſtize fault exerciſe pacience ſo diſmayde ſted profiting vnder correction ſhall nothing elſe ſtorme ſhall nothing turmoyling rebelliouſneſſe v iob pacient yet fayled make great broyle though bene minded ſtand defiance god infirmitie driuen therevnto god preſerued grace holie ſpirite sith cace ſtandeth ſo let v marke well ſtandeth v hande praye vnto god whenſoeuer ſhall minded chaſtize v trie pacience may pleaſehim vſe ſuch myldeneſſe towardes v may learne chiefly knowe hande profite ſelues thereby bee caried away oure ouerheadie affection although god ſuffer v toſſed fro owne fleſh carrie v awaye yet neuertheleſſe may pleaſe ſuccour v may haue wherewith ſence oure ſelues wee giue head affection meane whyle let v hart feele turmoyling ſelues though ſee v wee skirmiſhing againſte god vnpoſsible v returne vnto yeelde ſelues vnder obeyſaunce vvee ſee heere happened vnto iob therefore let v call vpon able ſet v vp agayne vtterly ouerthrowne thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne nowe let v come well head bee wicked ſaith iob wo • bee rightuous yet maye lifte vp heade ſeeing trouble beeing fil 〈…〉 reproche iob goeth forth matter haue expounded alreadie heeretofore conſidereth wicked lawe god ſhall condemne rightuous yet rightuouſneſſe aboue whereby ſhall miſſe condemned thing ſo well knowne maruell although god haue told v law damned thing manyfeſt ſelfe yet ſhall wee hardly finde one hundred whiche commeth poynt ſo hipocriſie hindreth v blindfoldeth eye yea vtterly blyndeth v ſo wee knowe ought beſt knowne moſt familiar vnto v beholde sainte paule confeſſeth although bin trayned vp childhood lawe god one order companie doctor great reputation yet notwithſtanding hee vnderſtood meening god law flattered himſelfe ſo puffed vp pryde ſuppoſing himſelfe rightuouſe liued ſaith hee ſaye hee thought himſelfe rightuous god ouerliking owne merites ſo bycauſe hee power enter owne heart ſaye god hath giuen v lawe euery man view himſelfe men might knowe howe nothing vnrighte ouſneſſe aſhamed thereof saint paule come ſo farre forward man bene trained vp god lawe therewithall lyued blameleſſe life neuertheleſſe dazeled pryde ſhall come v vvhat ſhall become ſuche haue care thinke vppon god vpon worde ſpred theyr vice leade law leſſe life ſhal become thoſe vaunte themſelues yet haue cauſe according day ſee theſe monkes theſe hypocrite theſe chaplaines papacie ſee whole rable theſe ſuperſtitious cloyſterers whiche haue gaye deuotions yet meane whyle ſome ſhall bee whorehunters ſome drunkard ſome full crueltie otherſome full treaſon enuie ceaſſe recken themſelues rightuous haue merites ſell depart vnto folkes therefore wee muſt thinke ſtraunge ſeeing saint paule ſo abuſed behalfe heereby yee may ſee ſo groſſe hypocriſie men wonder howe god ſhould ſo pacient beare ſo long doth condemnation god ſetteth oute vnto v lawe bee vnknowne vnto v howe ſhould attaine conceiuing iuſtice higher ſtraunger ſayde vnto v thou ſhalt loue god thy heart thy mynd thy ſtrength thy neighboure thy ſelfe man confeſſeth bee good reaſon ſhould keepe rule verie nature teacheth v wee bee created ende wee ſhould mainteine common ſocietie hath ordeyned among mankynde theſe thing ought commonly knowne euen vnto little child let v come comparing oure life whiche god commaundeth lawe ſhall finde euerie one v guiltie owne part come ſo farre ſhort performing god appoynteth v wee able performe one poynt euen ſo much thinke good ſaith saint paule able thinke good thought finde ouermuch experience vvhen haue made compariſon yet continue dull ſtill vvhich v feeleth himſelfe wounded ſo deadly wounde ſaye ala muſt bee fayne come god hee muſt bee iudge haue nothing alledge muſt bee driuen confeſſe conuicted vvho thinketh thus man although men haue doone deede bee condemned blamed yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe giltie much ſayde vnto v thou ſhalt luſt god hath forbidden v bee murtherers▪ theeues whoremonger blaſphemers rebel againſt word hath alſo forbidden v conſent euill vvho ſo euer ſhall caſte aſide vnchaſte looke ſame lechor god vvhoſoeuer ſhall haue ſlaundered brother rayled vpon priuily hated behold murtherer vvhoſoeuer wiſheth men goodes although neuer go take yet theefe alreadie god hathe onely ſorbidden deſire amiſſe paſſeth yet hee hath forbidden luſt ſaye bee tickled ſtirred vp euill deſire lyking forthwith wee bee tranſgreſſers god lawe finally doe men conſider haue ſayde heeretofore seeing wee bee ſo blockiſhe haue regarde ſelues lawe ſo cleere large looking glaſſe v behold ourſelues pray boaſt ſelfe bee rightuous hee able performe lawe god commaundeth therefore wee muſt thinke it▪ ſtrange men cleere themſelues conteined furthermore may take profit doctrine behoueth v call remembrance haue declared afore namely god lawe ſufficient perfecte rule whereby liue good holie life wit reſpecte v let v marke rightuouſneſſe whiche conteined lawe may well termed perfect rightuouſneſſe yea reſpect men ſay according theyr capacitie meaſure rightuouſneſſe anſwerable rightuouſneſſe god equall commeth farre ſhort bee better knowen angelles yee ſee angelles haue lawe written yet frame ſelues obeying god heere ye ſee alſo wee ſay prayer thy bee done earth heauen gaynſaying god obeyed fully hee reigneth heauen doe wee deſire conformable angelles ought bee ynough v ſhall wee haue ſuche perfection ought bee creature yea much ſay angel haue rightuouſneſſe maye fully match bee compared rightuouſneſſe god great oddes betwixt diſtance betweene heauen earth although rightuouſneſſe angel perfect reſpecte creature yet nothing ſmoke commeth infinite maieſtie god lette v marke well lawe giuen v full certaine rule wherby liue well whē wee performe inioyned v ſhall taken reckened rightuous god perfection goodneſſe yet ſhall ſo rightuous ſay worthyneſſe v ſo wee might deſerue anything hand owne free fauoure ſayth doth theſe thing ſhall liue god might exacte liſteth hande yet notwithſtanding neuer ſay wee bee debt wee bee ſo euer wee bring vntoo accepte excepte liſt although wee take bee rightuous thing bee ſeeming faulte yet god voutſafe caſt eye vpon except liſt ſaye except owne meere grace bountifulneſſe moue ſee howe double rightuouſneſſe god one ſet forth v law wherewithall god contenteth ſelfe bycauſe pleaſeth ſo ſecrete rightuouſneſſe ſurmounteth wit capacitie creature reſpect iob ſaith wicked wo vnto mee vvhy ſo ſayde curſed performeth thing conteyned booke curſed bee hee worſhippeth god curſed breaketh sabboth curſed honoreth father mother curſed ſtealeth men good taketh themawaye force curſed killeth hurteth neighbour people muſt anſwere amen ſay v muſt confeſſe haue rightly deſerued curſed caſt away god hande albeit lawe perchance writtenin iobs time wee knowe nothing thereof yet recorde ingrauen men heart ye ſee wherfore hee ſayth thathe vnhappie hee bee ſounde wicked ſay hee ſhall haue withſtoode god lead looſe life ſecondly hee addeth although rightuous yet lifte vp bead vvhy ſo bycauſe ſayth ſee mine affliction filled ſhame vvhereby hee meeneth god increaſing affliction muche ſay hath ſoueraine authoritie ouer men although ryghtuous yet may hee execute ſuch rigoure vpon may thought ſtraunge yet howe ſo euer caſe ſtandeth men ſhall gayne nothing checking againſt may well pleade alledge yet muſt fayne confounded god muſte haue maiſtrie cauſe iob ſaith wil lift vp head though found rightuous way man might aske queſtion heere howe iob meeneth hee ſhould bee founde rightuous impoſible hee skarce knewe himſelfe hee meante chalendge ſuch perfection true fulfilling god lawe haue ſayde heeretofore ſo long men continue owne nature ſo farre wyde diſcharging duetie godwarde anye parte thereof nothing elſe bee ſounde rebelliouſneſſe according saint paule ſayth affection oure fleſhe enemy vntoo god shall wee followe owne nature goe cleane auke god wee haue ſo muche one thought ſame wicked damnable ſo vntill god reach v hand ſhall neuer come vnto hath hee begonne giue v grace yea partly verely ſo farforth doe laboure towardes hee draweth v vnto hee guideth v yet wee come ſo faſte requiſite wee may haue ſome good inclination ſame ſhall bee weake wee ſhall limpe make many falſe ſteppes ſhall ſtumble oftentimes ſtart aſide right path yee ſee plyghte men bee let v come higheſt degree rightuouſneſſe let v take abraham holie father haue walked ſuch perfection bene angel ſayde theſe men haue fulfilled lawe none ſhall finde himſelfe blameworthie life examined god howe iob ſayeth heere rightuous yet hee lift vp heade true god accepteth rightuous whiche rightuous ſay hee hath gyuen v grace walke according although faultes v paſſeth mother rigorous towards v though haue performed dutie poyntes full ſhake th v beareth weakeneſſe allowing accepting thing good v whiche good ye ſee god dealeth faithful one place iob hath ſpoken impoſsibilitie hee ſhould ſay true ſo rightuous may come god ſay let v fal account let life well tried founde haue offended awhit haue fullie diſcharged ſelfe tone ſide tother impoſsible although fulfilled lawe yet durſt lifte vp may heade wherefore ſee mine affliction filled reproch ſhould ſay god holdeth ſuch awe wote reply ſhal gaine nothing herein iob bewraieth paſsions ſhould haue confeſſed well god rightuous onely lawe ſerue bridle alſo knowe higher rightuouſneſſe known v recorde good euill giueth v rule life know god hath higher rightuouſneſſe therefore behoueth mee ſubmit ſelfe vnder iob ought haue ſpoken ſo bewrayeth conſtraint hee acknowledgeth hygher ryghtuouſneſſe god rightuouſneſſe lawe ſayth ſee mine affliction filled reproches therefore ſpeake worde befell ſuche perſon ſhall become v let v inure oure ſelues conſider well god true peculiar rightuouſneſſe whiche incomprehenſible v let v honoure ſecretes let v conceiue thing owne wit wee ſee owne ſmalneſſe ſhort muſt wee doe truely condemning ſelues wee neede climbe ſo high ſaye god hath rightuouſneſſe whiche bee comprehended creature vnto man witte reache vvee haue doe condemning oure ſelues lawe bee ynoughe matter hath berre ſhowed alreadie often man ſhall ſo proude thinke hee mainteine himſelfe god owne workes let thinke himſelfe well looke vpon god lawe v ſay wee rightuous bycauſe ſeeme ſo ſelues bycauſe men find v ſo allow doings tryallmuſte bee made lawe god vvhen world ſhall haue canonized v saint ſhall nothing boote v heauenly iudge condemne v god haue v goe anye whither elſe lawe bowe nother one way therefore ofte wee bee tempted eyther pryde hypocriſie let v bethinke v lawe ſayeth v wee ſhall fynde ſo greate ſo horrible ſhamefulneſſe oure ſelues ſhall remayne nothing v euerlaſting death thus yee ſee howe wee ought practize leſſon vvo vnto v wee bee wicked ſhall wee neede come ſecond poynt rightuous yet dare lifte vp hande bee found rightuous furthermore let v marke wel bee rightuous ſay wee bee vtterly wicked al ſquare al rightuouſneſſe v ſhall bee franke free acceptation howe true faithfull called rightuous onely bycauſe god forgcueth theyr ſinnes receyueth mercie alſo bycauſe hee lyketh well theyr life ſayde simeon good ryghtuous man zacharie elizabeth wife rightuous alſo bycauſe walked god lawe commaundements ſame ſayde alſo holie patriarkes yea let v marke bycauſe god owne free goodneſſe receyued layde theyr ſynnes theyr charge vvhen wee ſaye menne made righteous ſayth much ſay god forgiueth ſinnes cleerely acquiteth lord iefus chriſtes ſake like wiſe behoueth v vnderſtand wee rightuous workes bycauſe god accepteth v fauour workes deſerue bee alwayes refuzed hande ſpeake workes men doe owne power nothing villanie rebellion euen man gouerned god ſpirite grace doth walke good workes yet good workes vnperfecte god might caſt yea ſo farre worthyneſſe deſeruing papiſts imagine nothing filthyneſſe neuertheleſſe yet god receyueth yea euen father receiueth whiche commeth childe though bee nothing worth although wee bee rightuous ſay althoughe wee haue ſome likelyhoode rightuouſneſſe let v marke well ſame deſerueth accepted ſo god bycauſe written curſed performeth thing conteyned booke lawe nowe man performeth ſo muche one thing meane performeth pure perfect mynd therefore followeth god may damne v ſo muſt fayne holde downe oure heades yea euen without going law yet nothing come god rightuouſneſſe whiche incomprehenſible v let v put cace man
