behaued hym ſelfe poyntes became him▪ might hee doe might hee therefore pleade againſte god no▪ hee muſt come ſhorte god oweth v nothing▪ true▪ hee hath pomiſed ſo euer dothe thoſe thing ſhall liue yea wee muſt vnderſtande hee hath made promiſe owne free bountifulneſſe vve ſee howe lord ieſus chriſt ſaith ſeruaunt ſhall haue doone hee maiſter hee ſpeaketh ſeruantes thoſe dayes witte ſlaues bondage bought ſolde ſlaue doe hee maſter ſhal maſter riſe table ſay nowe ſerue thee another whyle ſeruaunts dutie ſerue maiſter maſter ſhould abace ſelfe ſeruant bee bounde vnto thing euē ſo faith chriſt ye haue done al commaunded aſſure yourſelues ye ſtill vnprofitable ſeruantes ſo ſaying ieſus chriſt meeneth euer man founde founde haue performed god commaundeth putteth cace ſo alſo muſt let v put cace man fulfilled lawe yet behoueth reuerence god al humilitie ſaying ala lorde ſtill ſubmit ſelfe vnder thy hand knowe well haue done thee ſo muche one drop goodneſſe proceede mee althoughe thou accepte mee bycauſe worthy bycauſe haue deſerued thyne owne free fauour lo howe wee ought deale furthermore let v bee well ware exceſsiue paſsion iob behoueth v conceiue ſouereine rightuouſneſſe god ſuch ſort haue ſayde muſt end may induced humilitie ſay rightuous yet lift vp head ſeeing mine affliction certaine god performe whatſoeuer hath promiſed yea euen hath ſaide doth theſe thing ſhall liue certainely able performe law full let v aſſure ourſelues god hath rewarde ready reward v muſt ſay iob doth ſeing reproch ſeeing ſcourgeth v confounded power know although ſame bee far meaſure yet dare grudge againſt bicauſe ſhall win nought ſo let v caried away ſo far let v thinke god neuer chaſtizeth ſeruantes without iuſt cauſe yea thoughe hee haue eye ſinnes certaine iob puniſhed wicked offender true god iuſt cauſe puniſhe hundred time god reſpect meaning vvhat intent trie pacience cleare ſlaunder sathan made ſaying iob obeyeth god bycauſe proſperitie therefore god meant ſhewe contrarie wee ſpeake god ſoueraine iuſtice let talke bee thinke preſſeth v meaſure auaunce ſelues againſt force let bee honoure wonderfull ſecretes yea euen ſuche wiſe wee may bee fully reſolued ſay ſelues ala v alledge though righteous yet bee ſo bolde lift vp head wee haue good cauſe hang downe oure heades continually although god ſet ſelfe downe throne condemne v haue iudge within v euerye man condemne himſelfe hathe euery man witte perceiue himſelfe bee blameable let v marke need none condemnation v whiche conteyned lawe wherewith bothe great ſmall ought bee well acquainted iob hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth hee would fayne plague increaſed yea although increaſed ſayth hee yet wilte thou come vpon lyon wilte ſhewe thy ſelfe maruellous againſt heere iob treateth god ſecrete iudgements man reach vnto reaſon ſame doe farre paſſe vnderſtanding wit cauſe hee calleth god maruellous true wee ſhall alwayes finde god lawe ſtraunge bycauſe wakeneth v vp beyond imagination wee ſelues alſo ſee wyſeſt men doe ſpeake ſoundneſſe perfection come ſhort rigour god lawe alſo god teacheth v worde hee doth ſtill aboue ordinarie capacitie haue bin taught know matter goeth fully conuicted ſo god haue layde brydle looſe necke ſo wee haue bene ſchoole learne lawe wee bee well neere good brute beaſts behalfe knowe man muſt loue god heart mynde ſtrength neiboure himſelfe ſee god requireth nothing hand wee owe wee haue thing wee haue receyued thus ye ſee howe wee ſhall find nothing ſtraunge referre god word contrariewiſe god doings according reaſon equitie wee come rightuouſneſſe vnknowne ſay although performed whole lawe full yet wee done nothing reſpect rightuouſneſſe god yet farre ſtraunger thing ſo muche wee knowe ſay wittes fayle v amazed whiche iob meante ſaying thou wilte ſhewe thy ſelfe maruellous againſt mee nowe although god maruellous wonderfull iudgementes yet muſt faithfull ſort learne thinke nothing ſtrange howe let v take example god election prouidence thing hee doth aboue eur vnderſtanding behold part god ſecretes bottomleſſe pit vnto v ward god chooſeth whome liſteth bring ſaluation forſaketh reſidue hee findeth v alike ſo man vaunt himſelfe bee better neighboure wherefore wee ſo ſholed aſunder ſay god choſeth one ſort make inheritor kingdome forſaketh ſort make go deſtruction▪ cauſe heere firſte bluſhe thinke verie ſtrange ſaying▪ reaſon whereas wee bee v god creature difference betwixt v reſpecte ſelues one v lightly preferred another yet notwithſtanding god hath pitie whome hee liſteth forſaketh reſidue reaſon ſo lo men ſhal tempted grudge againſt god good reaſon ſhould bee wonderfull v wonderfull would always haue wittes intangled many queſtions ende would ſpue blaſphemies ſee theſe priuie repiners doo alwayes arguing making phantaſticall diſcourſes coulde finde heart condemne god bycauſe hee worketh woulde haue man ſpeake v god election muſt needes maruellous acte yet muſt aſtoniſhed ende may prouoke v honour ſay ala lorde wee cannot reach ſo hygh enter thy ſecrete purpoſe know incloſed therin becommeth v reuerence vnknown v muſt confeſſe thou arte rightuous good yea euen though appeere reaſon vnto vs▪ vvhen come poynt ſhall fling raſhly aduentures iudge god ſecretes owne fancie ſhall doe ſee faithfull time haue done verely diſpute god election ſoberly modeſtly crie oute saint paule howe wonderfull thy iudgementes▪ rauiſhed inquire curiouſly thinke well nowe wee knowe god doings parte daye come ſhall reuealed vnto v full lo faithfull haue alwayes reaſoned god election raunged abroade inquire thing curiouſly certeſſe thought verie ſtrange maruellous ſo yeelde god due honoure knowing bee great loftineſſe creature preſume attaine ſo high ſo continued quiet rauiſhed wondermente theſe doings god maruellous vntoo yet ouerſtraunge maruellous bycauſe knewe ſecretes whiche ſurmount capacitie vnderſtanding man agayne ſtraunge bycauſe election knewe god goodneſſe mercie hee choſen ſaluation calling vnto himſelf caſting reſt behold ſee god election much bee ſayde alſo prouideoce ſayde god diſpoſeth thing world vvell poſsible warres come ſhould bee god ſtirring vp god ſhould guide toſſed outrageous paſsions ſuch prince full ambition couetous bludſheaders rakers extortioner ſo muche helliſh confuzion ſerue behalfe make conſcience ſticking ſlea rob pill yee ſee men ill wilde aſtes much werſe ſhuld god vſe ſuch inſtrumentes howe ſhould poſsible againe ſee church ſelfe turmoyled ye ſee perſecutions put vntoo hee rayſeth thē vp furthermore ſee doctrine goſpell troden vnder foote tirannie wicked caitifes ſo lie reigne ſtead truth maketh ſuch trouble rightfull vengeance god vve ſee reaſon wee ſee howe wiſe worketh wee muſt perceiue hand fayth ſtraunge v ſo muſt needes end may humble v ſhall haue bin inſtructed god worde although knowe reaſon workes yet ſhall wee cuſtomably magnifie aſſuring ſelues hee dothe aught without iuſt cauſe yee ſee howe ſtandeth v hande practize ſentence wherein ſayde thou wilt ſhe thy ſelfe maruellous mee iob paſſed meaſure certaine hee ſheweth heere tempted outrageous paſsion hee ſayth thou wilt ſhewe thy ſelfe maruellous whereby declareth confeſſeth owne parte hee vtterly diſmayde thought verie ſtraunge god ſhould ſcourge ſo wee muſt beware hee maruellous v ſort true perceiue god maruellous ſecret dealing may well ſo abaſhed ſay ala lord ſee weakneſſe rudeneſſe thinke workes thy hand ſtrange thou ſhalt enlighten v little little vntill wee bee come thy sanctuarie vve haue one foote alreadie truly curtins ſee thee aloofe time come thou ſhalt giue v familiar knowledge therfore let greeue v god ſhould haue ſecretes ſuch wiſe ſurmount capacitie yet doth amaze v man may alledge howe ſo doth welfare happineſſe conſiſt knowing god yes verely ſo farre foorth expedient v let v marke god hath giuen v way know conuenient fit v could well giue v full perfect light day ſeeth profite therefore giueth v certaine portion applyeth himſelfe vnto v therefore let greeue v haue knowledge god yet meaſure giuen v ſcripture waite till haue bereft v mortall body ſpecially till haue wholly reformed myndes maye bee ſo wrapped theſe worldlineſſe earthlineſſe ſpecially ſinfulneſſe procedeth ſinne adam finall concluzion iob declareth wherein god ſhewed himſelfe maruellous againſte wit •• will▪ renue ſtripes fall chaunging true hebrew word whiche put stripe woundes plague ſignifieth muche record witneſſes witneſsings without cauſe plague god ſendeth vpon men witneſſes brought forth againſt proofes god maketh bring thing knowledge place iob ſpeaketh stripe woundes plague whereby meeneth chaſtizements god layd vpon therefore ſaith renued ſo much newe chaſtizements layde vpon thing wel worthy noted although find god working ſtraunge vnderſtanding yet notwithſtanding nothing hindreth v knowledge god rightuouſneſſe temptation doth ſay thing wherein men find themſelues moſt hindred true oft man alledgeth piece ſcripture v oure lyking ſame greeueth v fall arguing againſt god ſpecially weſhewe ſtubborneſſe ſmitten beaten hand god brought confeſſe god rightuous chaſtizements behold ſay thing whervnto made agree ſo yee ſee iob hauing ſpoken god wonderfull working addeth thou doubleſt thy plague mee muche matter bee diſcourſed length daye let v marke nothing elſe v doe flee vnto god praying giue v ſuch taſt word may quietly receiue whatſoeuer conteyned ſame yet whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe vſe rigour towardes v ſo moderate roddes although make v feele ſmart yet may ceaſe haue recourſe vnto father ende may alwayes receiue v child nowe let v kneele downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v knowe ſuch wiſe wee may anye bee blinded hypocriſie pryde fonde folly whereof oure heades full vtterly aſhamed may always haue recourſe remedie giuen v embrace redemption purchaſed v death paſsion lorde ieſus chriſt knowing ſame bee onely meane whereby wee may bee reconciled vnto god may come aſſured truſt hee heare v therewithall maye pleaſe ſo ayde v holie ſpirite may make v walke feare obedience vntill ſhall haue reſtored v fully remayne ſinne corruption v may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage error c the▪ xlj sermon fourth vpon tenth chapter 18 vvhy haſte thou broughte mee vvombe dyed eye ſeene mee 19 bin neuer bin bene caryed vvombe g • raue 20 shal portion dayes come ſone end let vvithdravve himſelfe quickly may take breath agayne 21 go countrie darkneſſe ſhadovve death▪ vvhence returning agayne 22 intoo darke countrie vvhere nothing darkneſſe euen thicke darkneſſe vvhere nothing diſorder vvhen ſhoulde ſhine darkeneſſe muſt call mynde ſpoken yeſterdaye concerning god chaunging plague witte god ſcourgeth men hee hath diuers meanes doe hee hathe vſed one kind correction hee hath another alwayes ſtore therefore let v thinke ſcaped hand hee hath deliuered v ſome one trouble let v prepare ſelues till pleaſe ſhew v mercie beholde meane ſet v reſt ſtand god fauour otherwiſe hee make v feele contayned ſong moyſes namely hath diuers ſorts chaſtizementes cofers ſtorehouſes meane whyle wee ſee iob beeing ſore preſſed deſireth god put death hande vvee haue ſeene ſame ſentence heeretofore heere hee confirmeth matter therewith hee ſhoulde ſay without cauſe wiſhe ſo ſeeing god perſecuteth mee ſo ſharply haue cauſe reſpite meanes vtterly confounded whereas iob ſayth wherefore haste thou taken mee mother wombe doubt ſinned ſo ſaying poynt vnthankfulneſſe men acknowledge ſelues verie much beholden god hee hathe made faſhioned notwithſtanding liue neuer ſo miſerably world ſmall thing god hath put v worlde reigne therein haue fruition creature beare image heere knowe father yea fynd ſo experience ought hold skorne ſuch honoure doth vnto v vve ſee iob altogither excuſed hee wiſheth haue bin caried mother wombe graue rather haue bin borne true made concluſion reſt fully vpon bewrayeth paſsions wherwith moued although conſented popiſh doctor ſay ſinne ſo ſay great beaſtlineſſe holde opynion man bee prouoked himſelfe vengeance robberie ſuche thing ſame ſinne ſo hee reſte vppon ne fully purpoſe hys heart rather eſteeme vertue bycauſe ſay bee ſuche battels man outſtandeth verely graunt baptim ſinne ſo turke heathen man tempted euill forthwith giltie god ſay ſuche ſinnes ſo ſcoured oute v baptim wee rather deſerue prayſe afore god conſenting ſuche temptation bee eſteemed ſinners haue done amiſſe earſt ſayd brutiſh beſtlineſſe whome dothe god ſpeake hee ſayth men muſte loue hearte theyr ſtrength speaketh iewes churche dothe ſame belong vnto v day rule common v bound loue god ſtrength mynde ſide bee ſo looke howe many lewde affection wee bee combered ſo many ſtriuings enmity haue againſt loue owe vnto god wee muſt needes conclude alſo bee many ſinnes elſe ſinne rebell againſt god haue tranſgreſſed commaundements ye ſee thing againſt nature true ſinnes layde charge yet enſeweth therefore wee bee worthy bee puniſhed god owne meere goodneſſe doth take v mercie let v vnderſtand ſo euer oure fleſhe tempteth v vnto euill although reſting determining vppon yet may god iuſtly puniſh v neuerthe later owne free goodneſſe ſpareth v ſo ſame commeth account iob therefore amiſſe oure ſide let v know god may cal v iudgement account haue temptation doth make v ſwarue little although bring ſame effect ouercome yet alreadie gone aſtraye behoueth v confeſſe faulte yet notwithſtanding behooueth v alſo ſettle oure ſelues vppon free mercie god graunteth forgetting buriyng thoſe thing nowe let v come iobs talke hee ſayth wherefore hast thou taken mee moothers wombe verely wee looke lyfe man wee ſhall alwayes fayne come prouerb whiche common among heathen leaſte wyſe among moſt part namely good men neuer bee borne elſe dye hande haue reckned miſeries inconueniences whereto ſubiect whyle liue heere lowe haue thought better men neuer borne elſe beginning life weeping wayling little babe haue vnderſtanding doe ſhewe ſuch ſeagulfe miſeries v pitie terrour beholde afterwarde growe yeares ſo doe miſeries increace number quantitie therefore better men might neuer borne muſt needes bee borne good dye quickly might haue long iourney make talke hath partly ſome reaſon howbeit without vnthankefulneſſe ſo although miſeries bee innumerable wherewith men oppreſſed yet muſt wee wey balance honoure god doth v making v lord ouer creature haue dominion ouer heere childrē whome hee maketh feele father towardes v morouer bycauſe ſetting v world aduaunce v aloft witte heauenly life wherof giueth v ſome perceyuerance feeling afore hande throughly knowne ſurely ouercommeth miſeries trouble happen men worlde thus yee ſee ſayde ſentence namely beſt men borne might ſeeme bee grounded vppon ſome reaſon yet without vnthankfulneſſe wee muſt forget god giueth v recompence withall ſo farre iob cōming point hee leuer haue bin borne bicauſe ſo combered minde ſo amazed harte ſo ſeazed forepoſſeſſed griefe hee could conſider god neuertheleſſe created owne image hee kepte worlde one child hee made taſt euerlaſting life whervnto men allured iob could come poynt hart ſo cloſed vp ſorrowe hee none eye miſerie therefore lette v marke well affliction bee greate wee alwayes ſubiect fault whiche iob bewrayeth himſelfe whiche wee forget god gracious benefites althoughe wee bee put remembrance yet wee finde taſte ſauour touch v comfort aſſwage ſorrow wee might take breath ſay lord although beaten thy hand bee heauie burthen beare yet notwithſtanding conſider ſide thou haſt bin ſo good vnto perceiue thee mercifull father cheereth vp comforteth ye ſee thē thing haue marke firſte place ſhould knowe vice naturally rooted v ſo god ſuccoure v giue v ſayd cōfort ſweeten ſorrowes ſhoulde miſſe bee driuen ſuche afterdeale ſhould nothing deſpaire v ſhould wiſh neuer bene borne nowe iob addeth bene caried mother wombe graue bene though neuer bene ſeconde part prouerb ſayde vſed among infidel namely men bee borne good ſoone diſpatched rid life haue touched alredy ſmal regarding honour god dooth v giuing v ſuche dignitie preheminence ouer creature muſtreth v ranke child heires ineſtimable priuiledge ought appeaſe griefes betide v specially let v marke purpoſe god haue v lyue heere worlde die childhoode wee haue nother vnderſtanding reaſon grow yeares ſo learne vnknowen vnto v namely god hath made v owne image giuen v vnderſtanding knowe onely wee muſte paſſe away heere belowe alſo continuing lyfe heauen thing whereto hee calleth v wee • e taken world wee neuer bene diſappoynted great benefite knowing god bee eternall ſauioure hee giueth v already ſome token fatherlye loue wee earthly wayfaring therefore yee ſee intolerable vnthankfulneſſe men wiſh haue bene rid way neuer beene borne wee muſte thinke vppon lyfe man ſimply ſelfe wee muſt ſet eye vpon end whervnto tendeth whiche wee ſhoulde bee led hope yet hidden vp heauen▪ whereof god gyueth v ſome taſte alreadye ſo farre foorthe oure rawneſſe able comprehende ſame alſo heere bee noted wyſe wee may wiſhe die ſorte wee muſte onely bee willing lyue alſo cheere vp ſelues though wee lyue lingering payne hath bene ſhewed heertofore maye deſyre deathe reſpecte wee ceaſſe offende god aſmuche wee bee compaſſed aboute ſo manye corruption lamentable ſee wee maye well mourne deſyre god delvuer v ſuche bondage onely lawefull alſo requiſite v doo god ſpirite gouerne v wee muſte hate ſynne euill neuertheleſſe ſo long man worlde hee ceaſſeth diſpleaſe god ſaye take euen vertuouſeſt man ſhall alwayes bee ſome faulte bee founde therefore hating naughtineſſe ſinne wee muſte needes bee weerie oure lyfe bycauſe holdeth v thraldome priſon ſo manye infirmity contrarie god ye ſee howe faythfull alwayes weerie lyue linger worlde ſithe cannot ſerue god fullye woulde wiſhe ſaye onelye lawfull alſo needefull v ſo doo vvee ſee alſo howe sainct paule ſayeth hee coulde haue doone ſo declareth beſte god ſhoulde take quicklie oute worlde hee reſpect himſelfe ſpeciallie hee ſayeth wretche ſhall delyuer mee hee confeſſeth hee looked owne preſente ſtate hee vnhappye hee deſyreth bee delyuered hence hee ſpeaketh throughe humaine paſsion zelouſneſſe wherewith hee dryuen holye ghoſt ſingular regarde hee giue himſelfe goodneſſe hee ſawe coulde bee doone till hee quite cleane rid fleſhe cauſe hee weerie lyfe heere yee ſee howe wee ought proceede behalfe witte oure miſliking lyfe muſte bee bycauſe wee knowe oure ſelues bee ſinfull howebeit ſo muche men cannot atteyne therevnto god fayne pinche make abhorre ſynne ſo muche wee bee fayne bee driuen force yee ſee one faulte v agayne although god chaſtize v ſuche correction wee bee warned miſlike ſinnes yet wee hate except hee continue making v feele ſmart withdraw hande wee fall oure olde byaſſe wee coulde finde harte ſit ſtill owne workes hee woulde let v alone yee ſee heere ſecond vice oure hating preſent life • bycauſe wee cannot lyue heere oure fleſhely luſtes notwithſtanding wicked corrupte vvee woulde haue god giue v leaue end yea could make ſuch bargaine life ſhoulde ſweete wold deſire nothing tarry heere vve ſee cauſe men weery theyr liues cannot compaſſe deſires hate euill corruption nature intangleth yet ſorie god giueth full ſcope lyſte ne ſuffereth • ake delightes pleaſures heere theyr owne inclination agayne yet one thing bee condemned wee keepe meaſure although haue good reaſon hate lyfe yet wee fall miſliking doone farre ſquare sainct paule place alleadged afore leadeth v cleane contrarie aliboughe hee call himſelfe wretched vnhappie deſire bee deliuered pryſon body yet commeth backe poynt hee contenteth himſelfe grace god gyueth beholde ſayeth hee thanke god throughe ieſus chriſt hee knewe well god woulde leaue without helpe hee knewe god woulde gyue power withſtand euill finally infirmitie whiche buryed god ſo ſhould layd charge paule miſliketh life man ſtomaked impacient neyther doth hee caſte himſelfe ſuche outrage checke againſt god cleane contrariwise yeldeth himſelfe vnto god good contenteth himſelfe god layeth euill charge holdeth vp ſtrong hande hee bee vanquiſhed sathan ſynne euen ſo ought thus ye ſee may bee lawfull v hate preſent lyfe bycauſe ſay 1 god holdeth v bondage ſinne againe houeth v hold meaſure languiſhing vnder god hande ſo long ſhall pleaſe holde v worlde knowing ought ſuffiſe v neere hand v helpe v nede wheras iob ſayeth would bene borne bene caryed mother wombe graue inordinate maner ſpeache although reſted vpon poynt doo▪ yet hee offended god ye ſee good cauſe marke well ſayd ſhall neuer keepe meaſure euen hande hating preſent life except conſider gyuen v god ende make v paſſe making v feele fatherly loue preſent lyfe witneſſ god ſhewing himſelfe good towardes v doth alreadie warrant v whiche wee ſee yet namely immortall glorie hath layde vp v wee thinke wee couet liue that▪ wee paſſe ſeruing god doe ſhewed v example holy father namely lyue ſette foorthe prayſe lorde▪ lyue come temple magnifie • ny god vvee haue regarde v maruell wee bee vtterly corrupted haue forgotten excellencie oure firſte creation▪ vvhat then▪ oure deſiring lyue brutiſhe affection bee owne eaſe eate drinke fulfill owne juſtes according euerie mannes complexion leadeth lo howe men ſtraitened themſelues without hauing eye vnto god poynt vtter wickedneſſe beeyng weerie lyue bee bycauſe wee liue owne eaſe▪ wee bee heere hild ſinne bicauſe god pleaſeth v bycauſe haue ſo euer fleſh deſireth could finde hart god ſhould bee ſubiect v bicauſe ourvnderling ſo thing fall cleane contrarie beholde greeueth v ſtingeth v tormenteth v wee caſte foorthe oure choler euery therefore ſo muche muſt marke leſſon whiche wee muſte honor preſent lyfe bycauſe god hath ſet v intent ſhould recorde v taketh v child bee oure father ſecondly wee ſo conſider ſelues namely wee bee corrupted adam wee alwayes hilde satan priſoners ceaſſe euill vpon knowledge whereof muſt euē midſt weerineſſe prouoke ſelues good holy affection returne alwayes vnto god aſſuring ſelues remedie al inconueniences hath made v feele ſatherly loue hee continually increaſe gracious giftes throughly bring paſſe hath begonne beit foraſmuche wee bee ſo ſore inclined repine agaynſt god let v well ware haue benefites alwayes throughly printed minde wee fall intoo temptation ſpoken heere wiſhe wee neuer life true better caſtawayes haue bene borne deade haue bene ſwallowed vp earth neuer bene begotten lorde ieſus chriſt ſpeaketh iudas yet meane whyle wee muſte holde rule lyfe man ſelfe ſo precious noble gifte god deſerueth well bee eſtimation wee muſte alwayes come backe poynte god neuer createth man hee imprinteth image true image defaced neuertheleſſe reſpect order nature goodneſſe god taketh alwayes vpper hande ought haue ſuche preferment preheminence among v magnifie acknowledge ſame accordingly nowe lette v come whiche iob addeth hee ſayeth bene carryed away ſorte mother womb • graue eye ſeene yet one vnthankfulneſſe life ought bee well lyked onely bycauſe euery v knoweth vpon condition ende created alſo bicauſe god oughte bee glorified v vvhen wee looke vpon creature whome god hath ſente worlde haue wee therein mirroure goodneſſe often may beholde man eye muſt make ſame ſerue v glorifie god behalfe iob woulde haue beene deade firſt daſhe much darken god glorie whiche thing without ſmacke vnthankfulneſſe ſo wee ſee howe hee ouerſhotte himſelfe thing hee hilde meaſure hee oughte haue doone therefore haue cauſe bee well aduiſed temptation befell vntoo ſuche man hee howe muche ſhall wee bee caryed awaye beeyng ſo frayle wee bee immediately hee ſayeth god woulde withdrawe hande mee gette awaye whyle myght haue ſome reſpite go downe intoo darke countrey intoo ſhadowe deathe nothing confuſion vve ſee heere howe iob ſtill caryed awaye witte bycauſe god iudgemente laye ſore vppon ſayde afore namely onelye felte bodily aduerſities euerie v ſhall ſeele chiefe greefe god agaynſt hee beene deadly fewd thus yee ſee pinch iob ſuche diſtreſſe tormented ſuche wiſe hee ſo pacient requiſite bee ſhort god bringeth v theſe ſpirituall battelles doth hee prooue v trie v quicke thing well woorth noting wee take oure ſelues ſtoute men warre haue beene tryed vttermoſt wee haue indured ſome ſickneſſe ſome aduerſitie wee thinke god ought beginne new agayne v wee bee quite diſcharged become ſtoute champion yet notwithſtanding bodily affliction indure nothing reſpect diſtreſſe poore ſinner hee perceyueth god partie agaynſt perſecuteth ſo hee finde meanes come attonement agreement therefore oure ſinnes come ſorte v diuell maketh v feele god wrath agayne ſyde oure owne conſcience reprooueth v ſo god ſeemeth bee vtterly angrie v ſay farre greater dreadefuller anguiſhe miſeries wee indure fleſhe therefore lette v prepare oure ſelues ſuche ſpirituall battelles praying god ſtrengthen v ſee man ſtrength fayleth behalfe ſo wee ſhall bee quickly ouerwhelmed wee bee propped vp aboue lifted vp god wee bee fallen ſette agayne right way wee bee ſtepped oute waye iob ſayeth lette gette mee whyle vve ſee yet better howe miſerable ſtate poore ſynners haue conceyte god perſe cuteth agaynſte wherein lyeth oure welfare oure ioy god neere hande v wee feele howe gracious fauoure neuer ſeparated v cleane contrarie poore ſinner ſo ſcared god iudgement deſireth nothing hyde himſelfe finde ſome ſecrete nooke god myght ſee hee myght make feele hande ſo greateſt benefite poore ſinners could haue feele themſelues ſo tormented god iudgement preace neere craue helpe ſuccour hande vtter vndooing ſhrinke away vvee ſee men god ſheweth himſelfe angry haue none ſhift heape wickedneſſe vpon wickedneſſe enter hell • ie hell wee ſhrunke awaye ſorte god yet notwithſtanding god holdeth poynt beholde howe poore ſinners wiſhe hee would make perceyue nothing wrath curſe heereby wee muſte bee prouoked pray god whatſoeuer vengcance wee haue deſerued ſinnes yet wee may forget grace whiche hee offereth v namely wee ſhoulde alwayes haue recourſe goodneſſe although haue good right bee angrie v yet neuertheleſſe may aſſure ſelues hee ceaſſeth allure v goodneſſe ſurmounteth rigoure iuſtice whiche due v ſinnes thereby let v comforted vntill hee haue withdrawne hand v let v ſhrinke backe hee abſenteth himſelfe v rather let v ſay lorde withdraw thine anger thou ſhew v thine angrie coūtenance one wee drowned alreadie hell lo wee haue marke ſtreyne therefore let v bethinke v profite oure ſelues wee quayle god liſteth trie v prooue quicke ſtrength conſtancie ſuch temptation yee ſee howe wee may ſay sainct paule neyther thing preſent thing come life death thing elſe able ſeparate v loue god ſay nothing diſappoynte v wee ſhoulde alwayes feele fatherly loue whiche hee vſeth towardes v aſſwage ſweeten ſorrowes withall sainct paule ſetteth thing come ſhoulde ſay true men ſubiect infinite miſeries neither number meaſure miſeries nature maze yet wee holde ſelues lorde ieſus chriſt bande betwene god v looke vpon partie knitteth v god father ſhall bee nothing hinder v ſhoulde alwayes merie lo wee haue deſire god hande wee knowe plyght wee bee nowe ende iob ſpeaketh ſtate ſuche departed ſaying go intoo darke countrey intoo lyghtleſſe pitte nothing confuzion diſorder night day ought ſhine iob ſpeaketh like man hath beleefe either immortality ſoule reſurrection promiſed v vvhere become let v marke place expreſſeth paſsions wretched ſinner ſeeleth nothing god wrath haue touched heere fore yet haue wee neede bee put oftentymes minde bycauſe behoofe iob brought ſuche hell minde hee thinketh god iudge himſelfe reprobate ſo hope grace forgiueneſſe lo wherfore ſpeaking death hee feeleth nothing confuzion howe ſo death ſerueth turne god order vpſide downe like ſinne turned thing vpſide downe god created man intent ſhould haue bin mortall true ſhould haue liued euermore worlde ſame ſtate adam god would haue chaunged v glorious immortalitie yet notwithſtanding ſhuld haue bi 〈…〉 ayn haue dyed neither ſhould oure mortalitie haue needed haue bin renued ſtate adam ſhould haue bin ſuch liued full time world ſhould haue euerlaſting heritage god ſinne ſtepped beholde god added death hande yea euen death wherein nothing confuſion thereby man coulde perceyue nothing god curſe vppon hym hath ſort cut man number creature ye ſee howe god hath ſettled v worlde liue heere child taketh v away bereaueth v thys life whiche one hee ſhoulde driue v hys houſe ſhoulde ſhewe howe hee myndeth recken v number hys creature see ye horrible confuzion ſo cace ſtandeth wee haue knowledge oure ſinnes god iuſtice wee muſte bee fayne reſt muſt thinke ſtraunge iob ſpeaking death ſhould ſay men go darke coaſt nothing darkneſſe diſorder ſo hee matcheth ſinne god curſe togither death ſo long god holdeth locked vp diſtreſſe certayne hartburning ſo ſeeketh meane grace true remedy ſhew v light euen death ſome order alſo darkneſſe darke ſoeuer bycauſe haue bin brought duſt wee ſhall bee rayzed vp agayne iob perceyued bycauſe behooued god firſt make hym feele hys ſharpe ſore rigoure afterwarde comfort hym againe text whiche wee ought marke well wee mynde receyue grace god giueth v offereth v continually oure lorde ieſus chriſte wee muſt firſt feele wee oure ſelues plight wee bee wee deſyrous ſay taſte heauenly lyfe firſte wee muſte knowe ende wee bee borne yea euen according wee bee ſinners adam good ſooth without cauſe sainct paule ſayeth whiche corruptible goeth formoſt hee ſpeaketh onely order god holdeth nature alſo whiche behoueth v conſider oure part therefore wee muſte vnderſtande although wee bee borne worlde noble excellent creature god bee yet notwithſtanding meanes ſinne death hath aboliſhed razed nobleneſſe ſo muche god miſliketh v diſclaymeth v though hys hande faſhioned v bycauſe bee disfigured deuill hath ſette markes ſtampe vppon v furthermore beeing ſubiect curſſe pronounced vppon adam wee good baniſhed oute whole worlde ſo neyther heauen earthe abhorreth v ſay thing wee haue marke ſelues wee enter intoo battell certaine wee ſhall confounded vtterly yee ſee cauſe men ſtande ſo muche owne conceyte cannot bethinke god iuſtice ought doo yet muſt wee come poynt howbeeit wee ſhall haue conſidered howe wretched oure lyfe death yet wretched bycauſe greate gulfe ſerueth ſhewe v importance curſſe god pronounced againſt v owne mouth ſay ſhall haue conſidered muſt alſo beware wee vtterly ſwallowed vp heauineſſe remedie remedie turne oure eye lorde ieſus chriſt meane whereby god inlighteneth v middes darkeneſſe howe oure lorde ieſus chriſt offereth himſelfe vnto v whome haue true dayſunne rightuouſneſſe nowe wee haue regarde v death dreadfull vnto v heere ye ſee dauid ſayeth god ſheepehooke ſhall comfort ſhadow death darkneſſe vvhen hee ſpeaketh god ſheepehooke meaneth hee ſhall bee afraid nothing ſo long god ſheweth himſelfe ſhepeheard towards ſhould ſhew himſelfe ſheepherd perſon lord ieſus chriſt let v firſt conſider minde iob ſpeaketh heere hee knoweth men conſidered themſelues verye nature haue nothing elſe manner confuſion life death howbeeit ſeeyng wee haue ſonne god although ſtate ſeeme neuer ſo wretched inſomuch wee bee poore woormes ſubiect corruption rottenneſſe yet come wee taſting benefite whiche god gaue v hee made light iſſue middes darkneſſe according ſayde creation worlde god turned darkneſſe intoo light seeyng wee knowe wee haue reioyce meanes onely ſonne hee hath cauſed hys goodneſſe grace ſhine foorth death yea euen lyfe ſeemeth ſhoulde enter intoo dungeon gulfes hell dooth god open v gate kingdome euen hee maketh v enter intoo dwelling place whereoutof wee bee nowe ſort baniſhed chriſt inlightneth v onely deathe intent darkneſſe whiche ſhoulde darken v quite ouerwhelme v alſo life thys preſent worlde scripture telleth v full darkneſſe wee bee poore blind ſoules yet meane whyle ieſus chriſt ceſſeth inlighten v hys goſpell vvee haue lawe prophetes burning creſſettes v wee haue goſpell whiche yet farre greater light yea euen light high noone yee ſee howe oure lorde ieſus chriſte bee ſufficient light v lyfe deathe ſo wee looke vnto haue touched heeretofore wee muſt firſt feele diſorder confuzion enuironeth v round aboute vntill ſuche time ieſus chriſt haue reached v hys hand furthermore ieſus chriſt hath inlightned v ſo ſhall haue walked hope euerlaſting lyfe world although god take v hence death eye yet let v therefore ceaſſe call vpon god tarie leyſure till comfort ſoules owne kingdome alwais incombered haue perfect ioy ſo long dwell body till god take vp himſelfe doo true thinke vpon death alone ſelfe without lifting vp ſelues higher god may bring v ſame point brought iob iob faith hope euerlaſting life yet little ouerraught ſuch feare conceyued nothing elſe death confuzion diſorder looked graue ſaw hell open ſwallow vp hauing ſuche conceytes greeued iob muche torment coulde indure body like god plucke end gyue victory againſt ſuch temptation ſo v likewiſe neuertheleſſe warned heereby wee neede walke warely praying good god ſhall pleaſe call v account iudgement may bee handle v rigorouſly according haue deſerued may pleaſe make v feele fauour hee vſeth cuſtomably towards wee may always come backe thys poynt namely although wee muſt fayne walke world middes darkneſſe ſhadow death yet wee may afraid ſeeing haue ieſus chriſt eye true dayſunne rightuouſneſſe ſame may cauſe v labour toward heritage heauen wherevnto god calleth v make v partaker glorious immortalitie nowe therefore let v fall downe maieſtie good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying hym make v perceyue ſuche wyſe wee maye thereby bee prouoked ſighe grone continually beſeeching pardon wee maye bee ſo aſtonyed iudgementes faynte beeyng condemned wee bee woorthy ryght bee condemned beeyng aſhamed ſelues wee may returne good god hee may make v taſte hys ineſtimable loue vſeth towardes v ſhewing himſelfe ſauiour perſone oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſonne ſo may ſtabliſhed hope giueth v ſaluation grow vntill ſuch time hauing incountred againſt aſſaults haue indure heere bylow may come euerlaſting reſt prepared v heauen may pleaſe c xlij sermon firſt vpon xj chapter zophar naamathite anſvvered ſayd 2 men anſvver man much talke ſhall babbling perſon preuayle 3 verely thy vvordes ſhall make men holde peace vvhen thou haſt mocked man ſhall thee ſhame 4 thou haſt ſayd dealing rightfull cleane thy preſence 5 vvould god vvould ſpeake thee vvould open lippes agaynſt thee 6 hee vvoulde diſcouer vntoo thee ſecretes vviſdome iudgement double rightfull god hath forgotten thee thine vnrightuouſneſſe ſake wee may better profite oureſelues doctrine wee muſt call mind hath bin ſaide heeretofore namely matter ſet downe heere true themſelues notwithſtanding miſſeapplied perſon iob thus ſee ye inſtruction good profitable v ſo bee haue wiſedome diſcretion know howe vſe aright effect done heere vnderſtande whenſoeuer debate maner man may ſtande god wee muſt alledge owne prittle prattle thinke preuayle vayne rhetorike muſt beaten downe diſmayde conſidering maieſtie god bring paſſe let v aſſure ſelues poſsible v ſerch wiſedome wee cannot comprehende worlde muſt humble ſelfe vnder thus ye ſee effect ſhewed v heere doctrine beene well hilde practized ſhould thys day haue ſuche diſputings reigne worlde wiſe men may iuſtifyed ſaued god vvhy ſo ſtabliſh deſeruings purchace fauour god ſight make beleeue may ſaue themſelues owne power know maieſtie ſpoken heere brabble fonde trifle cace ſtood vpon dealing men would ſo much boldneſſe ſee vſed debating meane whereby wee might ſtand god ſhorte men haue bin ſo beſotted wiſt iuſtice iudgement thing elſe came debating maner god loueth v mercifull towards v ſort might preſent ſelues maieſtie find fauour hys hande therefore ſo much ſtandeth v hande marke well doctrine ſayde shoulde men anſwere man muche talke ſhall babbler preuayle heere wee ſee howe men talkatiueneſſe daſhed yea though like well themſelues haue ſtore vaine fonde rhetorike beholde beguileth namely iuſtifie themſelues men beare countenance angelles whereas nothing want filthineſſe thē true may haue ſome apparant reaſons men ſhall like well deede according man reaſon demaunded rightuouſneſſe bee anſwered man muſt liue vnblameably muſt diſcharge duetie hee muſt euery man right ye ſee rightuouſneſſe ſaid man rightuous god though wretched ſinner ſinnes forgyuen behold ſtrange thing ſuch cānot ſinke man fleſhly vnderſtanding ſo ſay accepted rightuous yet ſame rightuouſneſſe whyle muſte bee fayne borrow another although god know wretched damned creature yet notwithſtanding ſaue purpoſe therefore sophiſters hypocrite ſtabliſh men merites beare hand able winne paradiſe oure owne power hath ſomewhat fayre coloure eaſily receyued moſt part world ye ſee cauſeth harden rankle ſo muche theyr ſeeming aſmuche men take ſayings woorth accept good god alſo ought holde himſelfe contented wee ſhall cace thereby although tyme god ſuffer v tell many fayre tale inſomuche ſeemeth wee haue ouercome yet ende muſt fayne come downe againe god appeareth ſeate muſt theſe diſputings bee fayne ceaſſe wherein men foade vaunte themſelues ſomuche nowe adayes vvhat muſte wee doo vvhen wee debate ſorte men maye ſtande god wee muſte alledge lykely reaſons ſuche worlde receyueth euery v muſt enter intoo himſelfe intoo hys owne conſcience poynt whereat wee muſt beginne bee yet better vnderſtoode lay foorth matter ſome familiar order haue tolde alreadye men come debating wiſe become rightuous according man reaſon ſayd muſt lyue ryghtuouſly true ſpeake properly rightuouſneſſe men lyues well ruled ſo fault bee founde performe god lawe hee commaundeth vttermoſt yea ſhall bee fully declared muſte proceede haue another rightuouſneſſe bycauſe wee come ſhort thys meane menne perceyue behoueth perfourme theyr duetie walke god hys woorde fall imagining thus themſelues vvell ſtandes mee hande fulfill god lawe opinion ſhall bryng notwithſtanding vnable ſtirre one finger yet woonder ſee beare themſelues hande able carie great mountaynes vppon ſhoulders bee able life ſo muche one ſtrawe neuertheleſſe ſo full fonde ouerweening ſtraine themſelues perfourme god lawe owne free well ende muſt fayne perceyue weakeneſſe owne experience true time puffe blaſtes yea another vice namely men ſurmize themſelues well able make themſelues rightuous without fulfilling god lawe howe fooliſh deuotions wee ſee papacie men deſyrous become holy rightuous mention framing life commaundementes god vvhat euery man take vp toy ſome good deuotion owne head ſhall ceremony ſhall superſtitions reigne vnder name god ſeruice heare maſſe euery day ſo mumble muche ſo faſt often ſo doo poore hypocrite beare themſelues hand haue well quitte themſelues god yea take bound vnto heerein ſleepe tyme man tell loſt labour fearce vppon ſpyteth ſaying ſo ſo goodly thing vnprofitable god vnrightuous muſt hee needes accept ſeruice offer vnto ſuch paine carefulneſſe lo howe idolater pleade againſt god ſeemeth doth great wrong accept take good woorth pelting traſh wherewith beguile themſelues lo dyzineſſe reigneth men braynes tyme yet ſayde earſt ende muſte bee fayne graunt nothing god preſſeth putteth tryall ſhall faine acknowledge ala little purpoſe haue heaped vp ſo many ceremony ſorte haue done yet doth myne owne conſcience reproue mee haue ſerued god well one poynte haue miſſed many others men beeyng reproued owne conſciences doo therevppon ſeeke remedye ſaying vvell ſee god ſhoulde enter intoo accounte ſhoulde bee ſore indaungered vntoo hym howe ſhall wee doo vvee fall finding satiſfactions like papacie euerye wyll confeſſe manne lyuing able fulfill god lawe yet meane whyle ceaſſe ſleepe ſtill bycauſe theſe wretched hypocrite beare themſelues hande able make god amendes bringing ſome payment true ſay thys behalfe haue doone amiſſe god wyll bee contented mee ſhall haue made amendes ſuche ſorte ſuch ſorte heere yee ſee whereupon grewe inuention woorkes ouerplus ſupererogation terme ſay woorkes yeelde vntoo god ouer beſydes due vvhen men doo ſo thinke euer muſt come account ſuch iudge maye eaſily ſay vvhat vve wee wherefore take wee ſuche paynes ſerue god ſhall wee thynke thys geere ſhall bee reiected hys hande hee wyll make reckening moreouer althoughe wee bee weake bee faultes imperfection v yet wee labour make amendes ſinnes god muſt needes haue regarde vnto ſuche ſorte men parte ſuppoſing themſelues throughly well diſcharged ſayde afore conceyue rancour hartburning agaynſte warning nowe wee ſee holy ghoſt condemneth heere wit men ſo flatter themſelues rocke thēſelues aſleepe vayne imagination ſeemeth haue gotten goale men like well dooings nothing wee come heauenly throne none theſe pedling trifle ſhall take place vvhat muſte bee done vve muſt know yea wee muſte firmely beleeue rightuouſneſſe world abhomination god may reiect filthineſſe ſo verie deede although hee haue graunted v grace labour vntoo goodneſſe yet wee yet come vnto although wee trauell thitherwarde yet ſuche feebleneſſe wee bee ouermuche bee condemned wee muſte call mynde howe hath beene declared heretoofore wee bring one poynte ſelues god haue thouſande confounde v yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne ye ſee alſo ſayde matter ſtandeth vpon babbling vppon alledging ſome reaſon may carie fayre coloure men eſpecially euerye v enter intoo himſelfe examine lyfe howe wee bee cyted god babbling ceaſſe euery man thinke neerely vppon himſelfe knowing wee haue none meane bee quit god condemning ſelues beeing vtterly abaſhed better vnderſtanding matter lette v nowe come whiche hee addeth thou haste ſayde dealing iust rightfull ſounde thy preſence heere zophar ſheweth babbling whiche hee condemneth verely haue warned afore hee miſapplyeth matter perſon iob hee doth great wrong accuſing vniuſtlie neuertheleſſe doctrine ſelfe good holie profitable lette v marke ſuche minde iuſtifie themſelues bee ſeene without blame haue nothing vaine babbling though bee taken wiſe folke worldewarde poynte wee oughte marke well men come applying bee ſmall purpoſe ſay well muſt babbling men come treato god ſecretes worde holy thing men deale pleaſure muſt go ſoberneſſe reuerence verely may good warning zophar ſayeth preciſely ſuche minde aduaunce power men perſwade nothing rightuouſneſſe god better babbler fayre ſhewe ſoeuer make therefore lette v learne doctrine ſo well ſettled grounded able ſtand god ſaue vtterly defaceth mē ſheweth haue thing whereof may make boaſt ſhort cōfoundeth thē ſuch ſort haue none refuge meere goodneſſe mercy god herewithall haue heere two article marke one thatwhenſoeuer talk holy ſcripture thing perteyneth religion wee muſte learne ſpeake ſoberly lette oure tung runne vpon pattins diſpute thereof pleaſure ſay lette v keepe oure ſelues ſuch vnaduiſedneſſe wee ſee vice hath bene cauſe god truthe hath bene vtterly peruerted turned lye proofe heereof elſe popiſhe diuinitie heatheniſh faſhion vtter ſcoffing rayling ſecretes god poperie lawefull men babble toſsing ſome tennisball good ſooth papiſtes ſay true vſe bywoorde holy ſcripture anoze waxe lo blaſpheme god aſhamed ſet downe theyr bookes yea meane proue men ſhould holde themſelues holy scripture wee haue aſſurance oure beleefe god worde wee ought receyue whiche decreed men see ſay holy scripture noze waxe true reſpect thēſelues haue made noze waxe turning wreſting forewarde backwarde make playne mockerie god truth come paſſe bycauſe haue knowne god vttering vnto v intent euery v ſhould enter himſelfe examine well owne conſciences apply owne vſe inſtruction conteyned holy scripture aſſuring oure ſelues god ment feede oure curioſitie tickle eares edifie ſoules yea might moſt behoofe let v beare mind article wit ſpeake god muſte reuerence feare eſpecially let v come ſpoken heere namely whoſoeuer magnifie men acquite iuſtifie god babbler though alledge neuer ſo fayre reaſons let v marke thē ſuch puffed vp preſumption allow men merites neuer yet throughly wakened know god much indetted iudgement ſo whoſoeuer ſhall haue examined owne conſcience well muſt needes haue mouth ſtopt cānot know mankind order wee haue nothing curſedneſſe v heerevpon wee may boldely ſaye teacher papacie vtterly beſotted become ſcorners god deſpizers rightuouſneſſe vvee ſee bolde aduaunce freewill magnifie ſtrength men make v beleeue wee bee able deſerue ſo wee haue committed ſinnes yet may wee well purchaſe oure ſelues forgiueneſſe oure owne good woorkes aſmuche talke ſo needeth ſaying ſet heere ſhewe bee deſpizers god bauling curres neuer ſo muche one remorſe ſcruple conſcience vtterly blinded diuell ſo anye ſeeling incling god iudgement certainely woulde babble ſo aduaunce owne merites whiche pelting traſhe ſide lette v learne go better ſchoole wee intende ſtande vp god ſayde heere ende wee ſhall haue ſuche anſwere ſhall ſerue ouerwhelme v vtterlie theſe dayes wee ſharpen oure beake vaunte oure ſelues owne rightuouſneſſe puffed vp vayne opinion rather outrage wee bee well able ſtande afore god ende hee muſte bee fayne anſwere v yeahee muſte fayne anſwere v ſuche ſorte ſhall bee confounded therewith according ſayde heere ſhall babbling perſone preuayle vvee may perchaunce weene wee ſhall bee beguyled haue declared afore hee make himſelfe rightuouſe god ſighte vaine babler ſay hee bewraieth hee neuer touched quicke conſcience ſtill ſleepe hee knoweth either doo well liue well hee taketh holde ſhadow ſteade bodie finally hee hath conſidered god muſt bee iudge thus yee ſee cauſeth men recken ſo without hoſt ſaide prouerbe nowe lette v come whiche zophar addeth yeal woulde fayne ſayeth hee god woulde ſpeake agaynste thee hee woulde open mouthe beholde howe men reprooued theyr confuſion witte god openeth mouth long wee reaſon men well euery one v maye thinke owne halfepenie bee good ſyluer ſoone god openeth mouth wee haue nothing replie ſay whiche wee beleeue ſubſtantiall ſtuffe bee muſte needes go grounde waſhe awaye oure reaſons ſhall bee froath maye bee greate bubbling boyling yet dooth waſhe vaniſhe away therefore lette v wey well ſentence god muſte bee fayne ſpeake put men ſilence make men vtterlie rungtyed behalfe namely maye preſume alledge aught owne fantaſies ſort ſhall god ſpeake hee hath alreadie ſpoken ynoughe holie scripture humble v withall ſee howe men condemned curſed adam marke ſpeciall poynte therevpon behooueth euerie one v peculiarly himſelfe yeelde himſelfe tootoo blameworthie ſeeing god ſheweth v oure ſinnes ſo horrible wee cannot miſlike ynoughe althoughe man bee greeued himſelfe lothe owne lyfe yet knoweth hee hundred parte euill god telleth v wee ſee sainct paule putteth men vnder ſhame ſo wee reade texte oure heare oughte ſtande vp vpon oure heades ſee howe wee bee condemned naughtineſſe although euery one v bee giltie alike fact yet v haue ſeede thereof within v yee ſee howe god hath giuen ſentence damnation vpon men ought inough make v ſhrinke downe oure heades make v vtterly tungtied ſayde afore men ſo ſtately cannot ſtoupe though scripture confounde according wee ſee notwithſtanding men thinke ſtill iuſtifie themſelues god greateſt difference betwixt v papiſtes namely bee demaunded meane oure ſaluation papiſtes haue nothing owne freewill merites satisfaction ſyde wee ſaye man beeing vtterly voyde rightuouſneſſe hauing aught himſelfe curſedneſſe muſte flee ſuccour onely mercie god ſeeke thing lord ieſus chriſt whiche oure owne perſones vvee ſee thing conteyned holy scripture concerning oure ſinnes humbling v god able ouermayſter v take awaye pride preſumptuouſneſſe fleſh therfore god muſt fayne ſpeake another faſhion wit hee muſte make v feele experience whiche conteyned holy scripture end may knowe howe vntoo v hee telleth tale ſpeciallie hee take v towell hypocriſie whiche keepeth oure eye faſte ſhet clozed vp wee reade holie scripture one whiche ſpeketh god giuen euill filthie infected theyr ſinnes corruption therewithall nothing elſe men vanitie wiſdom fooliſhneſſe thoughtes affection wickedneſſe enmitie againſt god rightuouſneſſe wee heare wee ſay ſelues tuſh ſpoken wicked none number euery man exempteth himſelfe furthermore wee ſurmyze wee haue wote goodneſſe v bee one poore drop ſtretch farre wyde ſo beare ſelues hande bee able content god throughly therefore muſte god come take away ſayde well witte wee may imagine ſurmize ſelues haue abilitie aſſure oure ſelues curſes whiche conteyned scripture doo agree pertayne vntoo v muſt needes wound v mortall plague wee may knowe oure confuſion thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne whenſoeuer wee deſire knowe rightuouſneſſe ſay howe wee become rightuous howe wee maye obteyne fauour god ſighte wee muſte conſider well cace ſtandeth vppon ſeeking whiche ſhall ſeeme good men whiche may bee allowed man reaſon euer maye bee alledged creature vvhat lette v heare god ſpeake ſay let v receyue holy ſcripture let euery v ſubmit himſelfe therevnto lette god ſpeake let v holde peace without making oure accuſtomed replyes furthermore aſmuche ſayde hypocriſie v behooueth v bee clenzed let v conſider alſo god iudgement muſte bee dreadfull v wee muſte aſtoniſhed therefore lette v beſeech hee hath ſpoken terribly vntoo v hee comforte v therevpon wee may take ſome taſte goodneſſe vvhen know certaine ſhall make much diſputing ſayd article bee curious ſerching ſort men may become rightuous firſte behooueth v vnderſtande nothing euill v heare howe ſayde euen hee dareth vaunte himſelfe moſt ſhall finde nothing curſedneſſe crowne heade ſoale foote againe though god ſhould finde v throughly well diſpoſed walke feare yet purpoſe vve ſhallbe alwayes vnperfect neuertheleſſe miſchiefe whatſoeuer god ſayth worde yet continue alwayes ſtill one poynt haue eye ſtill ſhet ſeemeth v howſoeuer worlde go alwayes ſomewhat v wee may warrant ourſelues owne workes god therefore muſt faine ſet himſelfe cace eye ſhewe v nothing v whereof may proude howe ſhall men doo ſo confounded certain neuer whit hindered thereby runne vnto lorde ieſus chriſt puffed vp pride wee ſhall haue luſt ſo bee v one ſtomake full winde whereby ſo weakned cannot receyue thing contrarywiſe becleare preſumptuouſneſſe hungred wee deſire nothing ſo much god ſhould remedie diſeaſes haue hearkned vntoo god wyth good ſay whiche haue firſt ſought ſhewed v holy scripture afterwarde laboured applie ſame owne inſtruction aſſuring themſelues vntoo thoſe holy wrytings ſpeake ſuch ſay eaſily conſent doctrine namely haue rightuouſneſſe ſelues ſauing giuen v grace lorde ieſus chriſt although god finde v curſed forlorne damned ſinners yet redemeth v ſayde confuzion whereof raunſome payde ieſus chriſt ſheaded bloud redemption ſaluation nowe hencefoorth forſomuch obedience ieſus chriſt hath yeelded god father ſet ouer vnto v one wee ſelues fulfilled whole lawe thus ye ſee howe wee may doo ſelues good leſſon bee ſhort man ſhall neuer knowe ment beeing iuſtified fayth vntill hee haue heard god ſpeake yea hearing hath made humble himſelfe bereeue himſelfe ſayde fooliſhe haultineſſe wherethrough men take ſo much vpon wherewith ſo beſotted lo zophar ment ſaying god would ſpeake open lippes agaynst thee ſayth expreſly god openeth lip deed hebrew maner ſpeaking reporteth vehemencie ſpeach like man treateth earneſtly matter ſo onely ſpeaketh woorde twaine glaunce layeth forth large ſo hee maketh full concluſion haue tolde muſt throughly well weyed bycauſe wee ſee howe men herken vnto god halues true peraduenture ſhall well heare euery worde matter great weight ſo long wee hold al god ſheweth vnto v ſettle ſelues throughly hee ſayth v therefore ynough v haue yeelded one eare vntoo god haue heard euery worde ſhall ſpeake vntoo v muſt heedfull followe ſayth throughly poynts ſhall haue opened lippes condemne v wee bee giuen babling ſay ſo preſumptuous ouerhardie bragge owne rightuouſneſſe wee ſhall bee vtterly aſhamed ſelues ſayde afterwarde god reacole ſecretes wiſedome verely ſaying ſo ſheweth iob might well haue bene puniſhed double ſay might haue twice much iuſtice executed vpon god might haue forgotten miquities ſake elſe might haue ſerched hebrew worde ſignifieth exect ſometimes alſo require account ſuch like therefore man might expounde god able charge ſuche thing ſhould perceyue himſelfe double daunger commeth one ende firſt whereas ſayde god reueale wiſedome iob wiſt ſhewe v knowledge haue ſinnes ineſtimable goodneſſe god paſſeth capacitie wiſedome neuer bee atteyned vnto man reaſon muſt come v aboue heauen haue warned alreadie geere miſapplyed vntoo iob deed hee knewe well ynough men muſt meaſure god rightuouſneſſe owne wit iob hath well opened poynt himſelfe haue ſhewed good caſe howbeit hādled amiſſe line wee muſt go namely take preſent doctrine generally may bee profited behold thē ſpeciall poynt thing whiche scripture telleth v rightuouſneſſe faith higher ſecret men attein vnto vvhat bee done god muſt reueale vnto v cauſe papiſts cannot aſſent herevnto holde themſelues continually theyr owne imagination knowe rightuouſneſſe maner heathen philoſophers man aske heathen philoſopher rightuouſneſſe life well ruled vertuouſneſſe anſwere euen ſo alſo popiſh diuines reaſon vvee ſay ſame true ſelfe muſt ſtep yet wit another rightuouſneſſe men whereof one droppe founde muſt bee faine haue rightuouſneſſe hauing condemned v perſons ſhould take v mercie lorde ieſus chriſtes ſake meane may acceptable holy forſomuch obedience whiche ieſus chriſt yeelded vnto ſet ouer vnto v ſayde geere entreth man brayne ye ſee take themſelues bee moſt wittie put truſt owne ſtrength bicauſe purpoſe comprehende man reaſon let v thinke ſtraunge ſeeing ſayde belongeth onely vnto god reueale owne wiſedome ſayd true ſo long men tie themſelues imagination owne witte needes iudge owne liking ſhall neuer vnderſtand rightuous god ſhall doo nothing babble haue ſet neuer ſo many ayre colour vpon matterial ſhall ſmoke ſo bicauſe know ſort become rightuous god ineſtimable wiſedome hidden man reaſon vntill ſuch time god haue ſpoke vnto v diſclozeth v confuſion vntill haue made v perceyue wee bee able ſtand vtterly caſt away curſed creature none meane v haue acceſſe vnto comming vnto name lord ieſus chriſt ſonne till ſuch time god haue ſhewed v ſhall alwayes giuen babbling ſay wee ſhall bee giuen fonde preſumptuouſneſſe wherewith wee moued tempted therefore god muſt bee fayne reueale vnto v wiſedome acquainted end paſſe bound thing ought know ye ſee effect touched let v learne oft tempted ſayde ouerweening owne vertues ought beare ſome ſway wee may well ſatisfie god owne deſeruings let v learne ſay returne ſpoken heere namely it▪ belongeth vnto god diſcloſe owne ſecretes vnto v teach v wiſdome ſo farre wee able atteine ſuch knowledge owne power flee much poſsible blindfold eye intent might put away perceyuerance feeling god iudgement v much therefore behoueth v marke wel rigoure zophar ſpeaketh name god meſſenger herault ſent ſummon v iudgement ſeate wee may knowe maner rigour ſame witte intollerable whenſoeuer god lyſteth vſe towardes v vvhat muſt wee muſt learne knowe bee humble ſelues wee may returne god hartie repentance deſyreth nothing ſhoulde come name lorde ieſus chriſt let v go mourning ſinnes ſo wounded inwarde conceyte iudgements may deſire nothing ſhould take v mercie receyue v vnto onely forgiue v ſinnes paſt alſo amend ſuch wiſe time come may walke obedience howbeeit ſame walking muſt ende pay merites workes make v returne fauour beſeech gouerne v ſuch wiſe holy ſpirit may continually call vpon ſue father nowe let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god father acknowledgement ſinnes praying making v feele may amende v ſuch wiſe may deſire thing ſo much come nearer nearer vnto vntil come thither full perfection ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father knowledge c xliij sermon ſeconde vpon xj chapter 7 shalt thou finde god ſeeking shalt thou finde full perfection almightie 8 ſurmounteth heigth heauens vvhat vvilt thou doo deeper bottomleſſe depthes hovve vvilt thou comprehend 9 vvydeneſſe broder earth largeneſſe greater sea 10 vvhen moueth himſelfe ſhet vp leaue vvho ſhall let 11 ſeeing hee knovveth men vaine ſeeth force ſhall hee perceyue 12 emptie man indued vvith hart man borne like vvilde aſſe aſmuch eaſie matter v conceyue howe humble ſelues therefore ye ſee god ſtandeth vpon doctrine ende may haue ſo much occaſion put ſame vre yeſterday wee ſawe god puniſh v muſt replie agaynſt ende ſhal find hath borne v alreadie▪ might right vſe greater rigour towards v heare v bicauſe ſinnes haue ſeparated v vnworthie bee heard forgotten hande reaſon ſinnes according ſayd wicked ſhal gain nothing thinke haue recourſe vntoo verie deede go vnſeynedly good god heare oute hande leaſtwiſe hee ſuffereth perceyue bycauſe good ſhould meekned ſetting foorth article lawfull men iuſtifie themſelues god generall ſayde labour vaine go ſeeke wiſdome vvhy ſo ouerreacheth heauens deeper • bottomleſſe pittes wydeneſſe ſtretcheth let v haue eye owne meaſure beholde howe man would ouerreach whole earth needeth ſixe foote couer man deſirous incloſe whole ſea imagination meane hee himſelfe nothing would fayne ſurmount heauens howe ſhall hee come thither hee woulde gage bottome depthes meanes hath withall neuertheleſſe let v put cace man minde able ſtye aboue heauen▪ nothing could hidden yet ſhould come ſhort god wiſdome bicauſe infinite▪ cannot bee compared eyther deepes heauens farre ouerpaſſeth therefore let v aſſure ſelues oure preſumption fooliſh wee go knowe reaſon god doings thus ye ſee effect ſhewed v heere vvherefore let v marke word wiſedome taken heere god purpoſe determination intent able comprehend true wee may well taſt ſome little portion god wiſedome like beholde creature ſheweth himſelfe vnto v howbeit partly let v take braunch ſome herbe wee ſhall ſee ſorte cunning god hathe wrought ſame lookingglaſſe hys wiſedome much reaſon wee come greater choycer work ſhould perceyue god wiſedome woonderfull thing haue taſt way perfectneſſe thereof ſpoken heere witte wee needes knowe god doth thing man deſyrous ſee end god ſetteth afore hymſelfe cauſe moueth therevnto wee muſte needes vtterly confounded heere firſt wee admoniſhed rawneſſe wit vnderſtā ding intent wee paſſe boundes play horſes broken looce wee ſee ouerweening pride oure nature driueth v therevnto hereby wee haue alſo conſider goodneſſe god applyeth himſelfe vnto v oure feebleneſſe leaſtwiſe taſt whiche incomprehenſible vnto v although conceiue throughly ne taſt fully yet ſheweth v maketh v feele ſo far foorth profite thus ſee two article well woorthy marked touching firſt haue tolde behoueth men cōſider rawe weake vnderſtanding bee preſume thruſt themſelues farre forwarde make inquiſition god woorkes hee willeth giueth leaue ſay hee willeth gyueth leaue do▪ haue touched already god goodneſſe doth vtterly barre v hauing perceyuerance wiſedome behoueth v keepe meaſure let v well aduiſed euery v haue eye hys owne habilitie marke howe ſuttle ſharpe witted wee bee howe greatly gyuen ouerboldeneſſe wherevnto oure owne nature eggeth v continually vve woulde alwayes bring god account doings vvhen meete ſtraunge thing men ſay vntoo v ſuch god good pleaſure bycauſe hath ordeyned ſo therefore muſt pleade againſt hym yea ſay wee dooth hee otherwiſe ſuche inconuenience inſue heerevpon matter may drawe quite cleane awke might bee profite thus ſee howe euery puſh woulde fayne haue god yeeld v reaſon hee dooth moreouer althoughe wee haue thing alledge yet woulde wee god ſhould conceale thing v wee myghte enter intoo greateſt ſecretes hath wee ſee howe ſore harte tickled thys reſpect true ſome bee ſharper ſet ſome bee yet common vice wherewith v infected greateſt leaſt therefore let v marke well tolde v heere god wiſedome ouerreacheth heauens deeper thā depthes alſo vayne v deſire comprehend brayne meaſure farre ſhort inſomuche man hundred time vnderſtanding hee hath yet could hee atteyne hundred part god wiſedome seeyng wee bee nothing god wiſedome bottomleſſe depth haue wee ſo much cauſe hold ſelues ſhort followe owne fancy ſeeking god giueth v leaue let come remembrante ſaye whyther goeſt thou thou poore creature thou entreſt bottomleſſe pit wherout thou canſt neuer eſcape warning haue follow ſentence way let v alſo beare mind whiche hath bin declared concerning fauour god ſheweth v applying himſelfe v ſhewing v workes ſo farre foorth behoofe profite know doth thys that▪ god applying himſelfe ſort vntoo v bycauſe bounde v bonde chalenge ſo ſheweth greatly loueth v ſeeing cō meth neere vnto v ſo familiarly vvee heare oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſayeth diſciples call ſeruants ye freends reaſon ſecretes haue ſhewed haue familiarly told commiſsion father ſo ſeeing god commeth ſo familiarly vnto v haue great ſingular record loue therefore let v learne inquire god work himſelfe leadeth ruleth v ſo wel worth marking ſee men incline continually ſome extremitie tolde already ſuch pride man heart hee would fayne know thing ſo nothing might ſcape euery one v gyuen vice vvell god ſheweth v wee muſt bee wiſe muſt ſoberneſſe content ſelues know whiche hee diſclozeth vnto v hope keepe ſelues vice therewithall enter contrarie extremitie ſaying muſt ſhet eye inquire nothing nay great difference betwixt meanneſſe nothing god hath made v hys owne image haue ſayd wee ſhoulde become brute beaſts conſent wee ſhoulde haue ſo little regarde light ſheweth v ſhoulde quite quenched v lette v learne knowe ſo much pleaſeth teach v god ſcholemaiſter giue eare ſpeeche able giue v wiſedome diſcretion comprehend learning wee cannot amiſſe lord ſhet hys mouth wee alſo muſt ſhet vp wittes holde priſon wee take libertie ſay would know would know god haue v know hee hath ſhewed v seeyng theſe two vyces reigne worlde ſtandeth v ſo muche hande marke haue ſayde wit ſhould vſe grace priuiledge god giueth v ſheweth v profit know vſe common prouerbe god ſecrets bee ſearched true ſearched ſauing ſo farre forth maketh v priuie ſecretes ye ſee howe paule calleth goſpell wonderfull ſecrete whiche hath beene hidden god yea ſomuch angells haue bene rauiſhed amazed highly honored yet neuertheleſſe ſame eaſie doctrine v ther god vttereth wil vnto v yea ye wold ſay ſo forecheaweth foode nothing v ſwallow downe boweth vnto rudeneſſe ſheweth himſelfe exceeding homely vve ſee goſpell ſelfe ſo high wiſedome wee ſelues neuer arteyne vnto ſeeing angells comprehende yet notwithſtanding ſuch doctrine ought knowne vnto v yea euen rude vnlearned ſort according ſainct paule ſayeth another place wit ſomuch god hath applied himſelfe vnto v ſecretes hid v add wherevnro god gyueth v leaue atteine yet true laſt day ſhall know thing wee muſte bethinke v paule ſaieth wit know part yea darkely ſo god giueth v ſome forecaſt ſhall reuealed perfectly vnto v fully transformed image glory long therefore clothed mortall fleſh let v acknowledge owne ſmall capacitie content ſelues ſoeuer pleaſeth god giue diſcloze vnto v ſome ſecretes god keepe priuie v mortall life like cannot know hee hath determined man faithfull haue ſufficient witneſſe god hath chozen adopted child inherite ſaluation yet cannot ſee regiſters heauen know whither written ynough god hath giuen good copie election looke vpon lord ieſus chriſt inſomuch mēbers doubt god auow child howbeit know bee companie choſen wee know bee caſtawayes yet know wherefore god doth one thing diſcourſe god prouidence thing ſee whole worlde wee ſhall confounded ſtreyt ſecrete ordinance god high v atteyne vnto▪ yee ſee concerning ſecretes hid v men muſt learne vſe modeſtie ſhort wiſedome muſt herken vnto god follow ſimply ſayeth without going ſay two thing wherein true wiſedome men cōſiſteth ſay heare god ſpeake without gaineſaying follow whatſoeuer conteyned woord ſo ſame may haue authoritie make v feare god humble ſelues vnder lo heere good meane become wiſe lyke behoueth v obey god follow ſheweth v ſo alſo muſt deſire know conteined word men wil needes wiſe againſt god become ſtarke mad vve ſee befel forefather adam yea euē time moſt pure ſoūd created image god far excellent noble ſtate men adayes image god ſo darkned v light almoſt aught el darkeneſſe v adam could content himſelfe ſtate deſirous haue higher perfection whereinto falne ſo foule ſinke ought henceforth aſhamed ſtate pray climbe ſtill ſaide highneſſe wherwith adam tempted wretchedneſſe falne rather tumbled cannot meeken v muſt bee puniſhed double therefore lette v learne couet know god ſheweth v haue ſayd alreadye yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſſe ſearche ſecretes conteined holy scripture nother let v papiſts ſay forbearing know autht bicauſe doctrine holy scripture cannot throughly comprehended men bicauſe men great daūger intangled many errours hereſies bycauſe ſee confuſedneſſe world ſpringeth men caried away fonde deſire knowledge terme haue modeſtie content themſelues wyth ouerwrapped faith beleeuing ſimply whatſoeuer hilde holy church ſeemeth firſt bluſhe hath ſome colour yet cruſed blaſphemie againſt god haue ſayde alreadye although doctrine lawe goſpell ſo high mindes able reache vnto yet hath god publiſhed law vaine neyther naught hath cōmaunded goſpell preched al creature yea euen ignoranteſt ſorte diſclozeth himſelfe ſo louing gentle faſhion man hee may familiarly acquaynted whiche ſhewed let v vnthankfull god let v accuſe haue ſpoken bottome bottle proteſteth hys prophet eſay calleth v vayne hath ſpoken huddermudder voyce ſoundeth lowd cleere ſo ought heard men v ought receyue ſith cace ſtandeth ſo let v hardily ſtudy god worde let v apply wittes therevnto labour ſhall vnprofitable furthermore let v vſe ſayd ſoberneſſe haue ſpoken heere ye may ſee paule meening correct fooliſhe raſhe curioſitie men▪ ſheweth whereto ought apply themſelues wit knowe throughly loue god hath ſhewed v lord ieſus chriſt ſo wee neede nothing el life long ſeeke diligently ſayde grace ſhewed v lord ieſus chriſt wee bee reſcued satanstyrannie ſet free bondage ſinne death howe whereas wee vtterly damned nature wretched lothely ſinners god wee become rightuous ſo 〈…〉 receyueth v liketh well v howe gouerned holy ſpirite ende wee ſhould fight againſt luſtes owne fleſhe howe wee bee reſerued vnder hande protection ſo althoughe diuell practyze ouerthrowe v euery minute houre yet wee maye able driue backe bycauſe ſheepefolde keeping good ſheepeherd jeſus chriſte hath promiſed ſuffer periſh whome father hath put hande therefore let v get knowledge theſe thing alſo ought continually preace vnto god lawfull v call vpon open mouthe bycauſe hath giuen v mediator maketh v way vnto howe ieſus chriſte beareth worde v ſo god dothe doubt heare v wee praye chriſtes name knowe theſe thing well tyme well beſtowed cauſe paule addeth oure heygth depthe oure bredth ſhort willeth men behold howe maye bee perfectly wyſe namely knowing thorowly grace vttered wrought vnto lorde ieſus chriſte heerewithall let v learne knowe muſt indeuer clymbe ſo high vnderſtand wiſedome god ſelfe deepe gulfe hee attayne let v ſure ſtrength come ſhorte therefore men muſt humble themſelues ſo lette v beare mynde paule ſayeth v namely ſhall haue ſtyed vp aloft aboue heauens ſhall atteyne knowe aught elſe fatherly loue oure god aſſuring ſelues therein wee ſhall haue perfection wiſdome whiche ſhall ſtretch ſelfe high deepe farre wyde ſides theſe wordes paule taunteth theſe curious heades fisking deſirous ſtye vp aloft ſinke low beneath ſearch thing ouer ouer yet meane whyle nothing vanitie nimbler bee leſſe ſureneſſe firmeneſſe paule therefore checketh men making diſcourſes ſo ſondly therewithall ſheweth giuen holding whiche profite would content themſelues ſhewed ſimply scripture heere yee ſee alſo moyſes publiſhed lawe ſayeth aske mo queſtions ſaying ſhall climbe heauen ſhall go ouer ſea ſhall go downe deepe yee haue worde mouth hearte paule applyeth ſaying doctrine goſpell wyth cauſe lawe ſelfe darke could haue contented men giue need full god ſent ieſus chriſte haue father olde time part god putteth worde mouth heart giuing v ſome little taſte filling v full ſo bee owne luſtes inſatiable according mennes luſtes verie gulfes meane thinges wee come inquyring ſearching beholde vnmeaſurable gulfe v ſo wee coulde finde harte ſwallowe vp whole maieſtie god packe vp glorie one little fardell hee ſhoulde reſerue nothing himſelfe seeing bee ſuche lette v remember well sainct paules ſaying let v apply ſtudie way long liue lette v profite knowledge lorde ieſus chriſt intent hee hath graffed v bodie hee may increace gift v day day vntill bee throughly filled lo wee haue marke ſtreyne forthwith followeth vvho hee let god hee liste ſhet vp hee liste let looce hee list • remoue hee liſte make newe order hee diſappoynte purpoſe vvho ſhall ſette himſelfe agaynſte good pleaſure hath bene tolde v ought bee ouer inquiſitiue god wiſedome furtherforth giueth v leaue licence ſame knowledge declared v namely lawfull v grudge againſt doings though oure power reſtreyne reaſon wee oughte like well euer god dooth although wee knowe hee doth hide v hee loth haue v conceyue reaſon workes bicauſe behoueth v haue trie obedience wee may know god ſhoulde giue v full declaration woorkes heere ſhould bee able indure pride woulde wee thinke ſelues bee although wee ſee wit bee ſo weake wee feele ſelues wrapped darkeneſſe cloudes vnderſtanding reach threefoote afore v yet man may ſee wee ceaſſe auaunce ſelues aloft therefore woulde become v god ſhould reyne v ſhorte moreouer honour yeelde wee god wee comprehende dooings ſhoulde ſeeme woulde bee hayle fellow well met wee ſee pryde v alreadie therefore good god ſhoulde trie obedientneſſe ende wee may learne glorifie dooings yea euen though bee thing v vnknowne though find ſo ſtraunge firſt puſhe make v ſay likelyhood ought go otherwiſe lette v ſay ſeeing god good pleaſure ſo behoueth mee yeeld thereto vvhen men come ſuche diſcretion haue greatly profited yee ſee cauſe god ſheweth v hee doth furthermore whereas mention made remouing ſhetting vp letting muche bene ſayde god ſhould chaunge tranſpoſe euer wee ſee yet ought wee gayneſay preſume ſtryue alleadge thing agaynſte true wee beholde order nature god hath ſet alreadie wee ought right glorifie certainely god hath ſet v worlde greate ſtage beholde woorkes confeſſe hee wiſe rightuous mightie yea euen wonderfull manner behoueth men onely bee taught giue glorie reuerence alſo bee throughly rapted aboue ſenſes vnderſtāding acknowledge crie dauid impoſsible atteyne wiſdome god appeareth workes although god ſhould chaunge orderlineſſe wherein wee ſhoulde beholde wherein keepe v occupied day yet neuertheleſſe ſhould behoue v ſubmit ſelues therevnto ſay hee doth without cauſe thinke ſtraunge ſayde afore let v learne ſay yea art thou wretched creature pray man haue gotten great vnderſtanding skill yet knoweth himſelfe men ſay hee wiſe ſay man haue applyed minde learning yea haue practized himſelfe affayres inſomuch hee able giue another man good counſell yet meane ſtarke ſoole vtterlye witleſſe thing concerne himſelfe touche owne perſone men ſay ſuche one hath witte true hath witte remembrance men hee hath diſcretion himſelfe euen ſo thoſe would reſtreyn god mighty power fancie thinke themſelues able cōprehend fayle cheefe poynt wit know thēſelues entreth himſelf looketh vpon himſelf throughly ſhall find himſelf vtterly vnskilfull weake therfore hath great need walke modeſtly humbly god ye ſee men caried away haue neither reaſon diſcretion go ſort cōprehend god mightie power conceyts much therfore behoueth v marke well leſſon whether god ſhet vp let chaunge muſt therfore ceaſſe honour mightie power ſuch maner ſheweth ſame vnto v although wee knowe reaſon worketh wiſe yet notwithſtanding wee muſte learne glorifie poynts ſaying lord good reaſon thing ſhuld lawful thee thou ſhouldſt vſe thy creature pleaſeth thee ſo thou mighteſt pul heauens raiſe vp earth aloft ſhort whenſoeuer thou dealeſt thou liſteſt thy creature thou paſſeſt beyond thine owne right neither vſurpeſt thou man right al thine due behold ſay ſort men ought glorifie goodneſſe mightie power god yet al muſt father lawleſſe power vpon god popiſh teacher terme curſed diueliſh thing cōfeſſe ſchooles god might abſolute power thunder vpō angel damne thē call abſolute power god wrongfull tyrannous power let v take good heede ſurmize god tyran doth al thing indifferē •• e vprightneſſe neuertheleſſe hath purpoſe hidden frō v therfore becōmeth v honor rightuouſneſſe though vnknowne v wit vnderſtanding vnable arte • ne therevnto haue remember ſtreyne seeing cace ſtandeth ſo mortall men lift vp themſelues agaynſt god withſtande mightie power finde fault rightuouſneſſe though ſhoulde pleaſe alter order nature remoue ſhift thing pray muſt wee needes bee vnthankfull▪ forwarde murmur agaynſt god preſent orderlineſſe ſee ſo beautifull wherein▪ nothing foūd fault let v put cace god turned light darkeneſſe sunne tumbled downe deepe earth mounted vp high al thing confounded togither▪ yet ought glorifie god ſay▪ lord ſo aſtoniſhed theſe thing right ſtrange v vouchſafe thou hold v awe vntill thou haue ſhewed v good thus yee ſee haue doo nowe ſuch orderly diſpoſition world ſpite teeth forced ſay ſuch workemanſhip creature able atteyne vnto muſt mindes bee ouermalicious wee cannot glorifie god lowlineſſe true wee ſee ſome confuzion preſent order nature whereof commeth god diſpoſeth thing bee wiſhed ſeemeth ſhould turned vpſide downe wherof cōmeth ſinnes cauſe god continueth thing ſame order ſet beginning wee make many confuzed midlies yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt cace deeme god vpright iudge herewithall let v beare mind cōfoundeth order nature ſuch wiſe maketh v feele hys fatherly goodneſſe mercie continually therefore ſo much ought induced humilitie weeſee greatneſſe goodneſſe mercie paſſeth hougeneſſe enormitic ſinnes thus much concerning ſentence addeth alſo god knoweth men vanitie men nōthing worth ſhoulde vnderſtande man borne ſillie wilde aſſe knoweth himſelfe yet thinketh himſelfe able match mightie power concluſion doctrine wee haue heard diſcourſe hath beene made concerning god mightie power reacheth aboue heauens deeper deepes therfore men take vpon inquiſitiue muſt vnderſtand bee ſwallowed vp needes giue curiouſneſſe bridle ſearch bottome god power muſt fayne ſhew lawfull creature lift vp thēſelues againſt whatſoeuer thus ye ſee declaration ſerueth applie general doctrine preſent purpoſe whiche god ſide knoweth men ſide men ſuch thing ſhould haue cauſe aduaunce themſelues call god reckening let v little conſider birth men like wilde aſſes ſay haue none vnderſtanding except god giue touching firſt poynt without cauſe ſayth god knoweth men vanitie bee nothing worth ende wee ſhould learne value ſelues reaſon ordinarie maner vvhen men value themſelues owne fancie beleeue themſelues thereafter giue verdit nothing worth wee muſt eſteeme ſelues according god hath ſpoken none alone may cōpetent iudge • know bee hath authori 〈…〉 e ſay it▪ thing wee ought marke well men haue valued themſelues owne imagination opinion ſhall haue gayned it▪ like whē foole calleth himſelfe king ſome countrie meane euery man laughes ſcorne labor vve double fooles wee weene ſelues bee thing withall god ſheweth v howe nothing vanitie v let v mind men deſirous know ſtate eſtimation effect bee muſt turne god▪ ſaying lorde thou knoweſt v thou haſt made v hād ſhall haue ſhort reſolute anſwere vve ſee ſcripture ſayth wiſdome men ſuppoſe themſelues haue ſtarke follie wyſer wene themſelues dullardes god laugheth fondneſſe ſcorne thinke climbe vp high withdraweth himſelfe muſt faine wanze away owne imagination lo scripture pronounceth ſo let v aſſure ſelues none god knoweth v truly tell cauſe ſayd god knoweth ſeemeth firſt bluſh common thing euerye man eaſily eaſily confeſſe god knoweth men vanitie yet wee conſider ſubſtance thoſe wordes import bicauſe men haue eye ſtopped know themſelues full vanitie therefore god fayne make feele may learne humble themſelues thus muche firſt poynt ſecond emptie man ſhall indued hart ſhall like wild aſſes colt brought backe birth v vnderſtand al wit haue god gift beſides nature let v looke vpon power men vvhen little babe commeth mother wombe wiſedome bringeth verely ſome philoſophers haue well ſuppoſed al vnderſtanding haue ſelues onely memorie requiſite v haue one ſence inclozed v afore hand yet ſeene childe hath leſſe wit ſillieſt beaſt let man looke throughout ſhall finde beaſt ſo brutiſhe ſo vnpurueyed reaſon vnderſtanding men comming world ye ſee man himſelf foale wilde aſſe let • ake great account himſelfe hee liſteth yet wee ſee hee neuertheleſſe howe wee haue ſpirit vnderſtanding wee come full age god muſt fayne giue v ſo ſee ſayde emptie man ſhall indued hart scripture woorde harte importeth vnderſtanding let v marke ſhewed haue wit reaſon ſame commeth owne nature neyther wee poſſeſſe though grew vp v behoueth v know excellent benefite god beſtoweth vpon v seeing haue hande vnthankfulneſſe v abuſe againſt therefore let v acknowledge benefite giuing v wiſedome diſcretion come age knowe ſelues honour let v learne hold ſelues humilitie according pleaſeth god giue v vnderſtanding let v acknowledge ſame come let v pray make v applie wittes ſuch vſe may alwayes walke holde ſelues vnder awe vntill beeing ſet free bondage ſinne conueyed heauenly glorie beholde perfectly let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v perceyue graunt v grace applie wittes indeuer conſider wit wretched vaine vnprofitable creature vnable thing ſelues ſo muſt ſayne furniſh ſtrengthen v elſe wee muſt needes vtterly quayle ſuch knowledge owne weakeneſſe feebleneſſe may prouoke v returne greater deſire grace good god offereth v ſeeking nothing bee filled ſame ende wee may honour magnifie reſpects vntill hee haue brought v perfection wherevnto bee called without ſwaruing one way feare turning right way ſaluation may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people c xliiij sermon thirde vpon xj chapter 13 thou prepare thine hart ſtretch thy handes vnto 14 thou put iniquitie thee vvhich thy hande vnrightuouſneſſe abide thy tent 115 mayſt thou lift vp thy face vvithout ſpot thou ſhalt ſure ſhalt afrayde 16 thou ſhalt forget thy miſerie ſhalt haue remembrance vvaters paſſed 17 time ſhall ſpring vp bright noone day ſo ſhalt thou ſhine bee morning 18 thou ſhalt ſafe bicauſe hope thou ſhalt dig pit lay thee dovvne ſafely 19 thou ſhalt reſt thee ſhall bee noman make thee afrayed many ſhall ſue thee 20 eye vvicked ſhall ſayle forgo refuge hope ſhall turned anguiſh minde wee haue ſeene heretofore lowlineſſe ought bee men thinke vppon god work wit muſt preſume iudge owne fancie muſt vnderſtande foraſmuch god wiſdome infinite therefore cannot comprehend reaſon doings foraſmuch able thing man ought preſume let giue leaue doo hee thinketh good al men ought ſtoupe vnto behold ſecond point zophar addeth deſirous god ſhould fauourable merciful v muſt ſeeke pure right meening minde without hypocriſie thus ye ſee effect declared afterward concluſion addeth ſuch ſmitten god hand cannot excuſe themſelues howe ſoeuer cace ſtandeth owne ſinne ſhould cauſe miſerie indure verely ſuch thing miſapplied iobs perſon yet notwithſtanding ſame ceaſſeth good v therefore let v bethinke v profite ſelues firſt whereas told v god gracious ſuch ſeeke vnfaynedly ſame often ynough warranted v holy ſcripture god allureth vnto deceyue ſayth turne vnto wil turne vnto hereby declareth hee alwayes willing readie v good let ſide let v marke whenſoeuer ſeeke god bee hande v yea euen grace bliſsing wee muſt alſo marke meane ſeeking god ſee men beare themſelues hand haue deſired nothing god ſhould mercifull haue bene deſirous yeeld themſelues vnto cheef deſire honour yet draw quite cleane backwarde text declared wiſe god ſerued requireth alloweth therefore ſayth firſt wee must ſettle heart ſtretch handes vnto afterwarde put wickedneſſe hand none may dwel houſes behold ſay men may obey god turne aſide namely beginning ſoundneſſe heart bycauſe god abhorreth diſsimulation contrarywiſe ſee hypocriſie reigneth ſuch wiſe nature hart ſhrinketh alwayes backeward make many
