countenance many apiſh toyes mowes ſo ſhoulde ſeeme altogither fire zeale godward outwardly ſhall full ceremony apparant pretence whereas notwithſtanding ſhal truth right meening inwardly hart ye ſee haue ſo much neede marke ſayd namely ſuch go ſeeke god thing aughtworth inſteade going forwarde draw backwarde except hart diſpoſed way ſay except haue pure ſingle affection double heart▪ better confirmation leſſon wee muſt bethinke v textes scripture god auoucheth like mortall creature reſt vpon outward ſhewes thing bycauſe wee bee fleſhly wee make much ſeemeth gay god ſuch one therefore wee muſt meaſure metyard foraſmuch peculiar office ſearche bottome mennes pr 〈…〉 thoughtes muſt needes layd open therefore eye looke vnto faithfulneſſe truth ſayde ieremie bee ſhort ſeruice god ought bee grounded vpon ſinglehartedneſſe wherof scripture ſpeaketh ſo oft ſaying thou ſhalt bee ſounde mee without cauſe god giue rule abraham gaue ende ſhould bee generall faythfull often repeating ſhew god mindeth ſhoale owne child ſome certaine marke hypocrite alwayes ſetteth downe ſayde ſoundhartedneſſe therefore let v marke well foraſmuche god truth hee bee ſerued ſpirite truth ſeeing god ſeruice ſpirituall • eyning vntruth muſt bee farre v otherwiſe althoughe workes pleaſe men neuer ſo much commended worlde bee better dung vanitie god reiect wee haue wee haue firſt indeuered put harte order true papiſtes take holde text proue freewill ſeemeth haue fayre colour ſay ſith men exhorted order harte aright therefore abilitie power ſo fonde tryfling reaſon meaſure men power abilitie thing commaunded god ſheweth v wee haue doo reſpecteth wee able v reſpecteth bee bound vnto dutie vvhen willeth v loue hart ſtrength power bicauſe findeth man liuing able yeelde whole hart ſayde loue vve ſee flat contrarie nature fully bent agaynſt god god ment require nothing handes able performe hee ſhoulde let v go ſtreight deſtruction let v thinke god lozeth right bicauſe wee haue wherewith pay put cace man dette reaſon creditours ſhoulde loze right bicauſe falne pouertie waſting goodes riot exceſſe true ſhall able recouer hande yet doth dette remayne alwayes vpon head seeing cace ſuch doo wee thinke god disfeated duetie bicauſe men bee altogither lewde frowarde bicauſe diuell holdeth bondage giuen ouer miſcheef wickedneſſe muſt conclude men able diſpoſe owne hart themſelues pleaſure owne motiō bycauſe god commaundeth ſo hee doth onely ſhewe bounde ſo euer able attempt ſhall eſteemed receyued god hande vntill ſuch tyme wee haue ſayd pureneſſe hart whereof mention made thys place nowe let euery man examine hymſelfe ſhall fynd ſelues haue hart ſtone ſo nothyng hardneſſe nother reigneth thyng naughtineſſe ſuche continuall ſtubborneſſe meanes bowed obey god sith cace ſtandeth ſo god muſte fayne put hys hande hath alſo promiſed doo ſayeth hee giue v fleſhly harte ſhall ſoft plyable ſo wee may ſerue ſayeth ingraue law ſuch ſorte harte bowel wee ſhall giue ſelues alloweth ſo ſhall one conformitie agreement beweene deſires affection betweene rightuouſneſſe conteyned lawe ſay peculiar worke god therfore behoueth diſpoſe v ſeruing bycauſe vnfit one oure behalfe drawing altogither backe hauing aught luſtes contrarietie goodneſſe lo belongeth god apply v vnto himſelfe make v fitte able ſerue ſeeing haue abilitie meane ſelues hath thus ſpoken pureneſſe rightfull meening hart hee ſayeth wee muste ſtretch handes vntoo god thys importeth muche vnder one particular zophar ment comprehende effecte cheefe poynt god ſeruice firſt table lawe el prayer recorde faith wee haue godward calling vppon god without hypocriſie witneſſe openly welfare lyeth hym onely partie whome ought flee ſuccoure ſhorte calling vpon god wee yeelde hym glory belongeth vnto hym whych reſerueth hymſelfe ſo let v marke vnder thys one particular point calling vpon god zophar ment comprehende whole content fyrſte table whych god telleth v muſt worſhipped v cā abide haue copartener muſt abuſe name vnhalowe wee muſt render hym honour worthy followe order hath appointed hys church thyngs bee throughly conſidered certayn calling vpon god proteſt haue none god alone renounce idolatrie ſuperſtition ſhewing truſt ſettled vppon hym alone declaring ryghtuouſneſſe power life wholly god fountain behoueth v drawe wee bee ſo greatly bounde indetted vnto impoſsible v diſcharge ſelues towardes hym beholde ſort hys name ſhall honored agayne yeelding ſelues ouer prouidence prayer meane obſerue ſpirituall sabboth reſt beſides thys prayer importeth confeſſion fayth alſo deſire god vouchſafe ſuccour v alſo yeeld thankes benefites haue receyued hys hand ſo wee ſee vnder calling vpō god cōprehended whatſoeuer perteyneth honour heereby ſee poperie ſeruice god hath onely bene peruerted marred alſo good vtterly aboliſhed true men eaſily ſay ought pray vnto god maner come thyther ſay papiſtes muſt runne trotte sainct sainct virgin marie muſt mother mercie treaſurie ſaluation euery sainct muſte haue office thither muſt men haue recourſe muſt repoſe truſt god muſte haue little ſprinkling ſomuch ſhall hardly knowne ſo great number wee muſt wiſe begin beare themſelues hand go firſt heeſaincts sheeſaincts god ſhaketh thē ieſus chriſt ſpeaking ſeeking vnto mediator hee ſhoulde make way god father thys geere haue skill meeneth seeing principall poynt perteineth god honor obſerued let v aſſure ſelues euē ſo reſt inferiour therefore let v thanke good god drawing v theſe horrible dungeon ſhewing v whome muſt hold ſelues muſt call vpō father take heede keepe way wherby ſheweth v come vnto namely aſſuring ſelues hys ſeate terrible vnto v make v ſhunne rather amiable v come vnto aſmuch lord ieſus chriſt reacheth v hand office make interceſsion v god alſo hath opened v gate deſiring nothing v day day ſhould come vnto lette v ſay acknowledge ſame ineſtimable benefite vnto v therwithall let v haue pitie vpon theſe blynde wretch whyche go aſtray manner ſomuch come poynt calling vpon god wote end begin verely hereby appereth ſtate moſt miſerable wherein lieth al welfare men wherein al happineſſe haue ſayde haue theyr recourſe vnto god according ſayd whoſoeuer calleth vpō name lord ſhal ſafe cace ſtandeth ſo wretched papiſtes wote calling vpō god therefore muſt concluded muſte needes bereft al hope ſaluation baniſhed god kingdome ſeing know call vpon god appeereth come doubting trembling therewithall haue thouſand windlaſſes come god bycauſe haue ieſus chriſt guide foreleader let v marke wel ſtreyne wherein mention made ſtretching handes vnto god vvhy ſo aſmuch cannot ſtye vp heauē reaſon infirmity behoueth v haue ſome ſigne may ſerue make outward proteſtatiō inwarde ſecrete ye ſee harte cannot ſeene▪ pray vnfainedly hart lifteth ſelfe vp aloft much came god lay foorth euer haue within v ſay inuiſible neuertheleſſe holding vp hand vnto god declare haue refuge thus ſee prayer betokened ſigne holy ſcripture ſame ſigne whole principall poynt prayer hypocrite skil wel ynough ſtretch hand armes ſeemeth euer thē burning fire yet al nothing falſhod mocke god therefore behoueth ſigne true ſcripture alſo preſuppoſeth ſo ye ſee alſo ſayde heart muſt diſpoſed zophar ſayde ſtretch thy handes vnto god men myght haue alledged god contented come ceremony ſayth afore thing heart muſt ſound ſo wrything crokedueſſe much ſay ſame muſt layd foūdacion whervpon build hereby ſee lifting vp hand vnto heauē nothing vnles hart go ſo hāds may true recorde man god himſelfe knoweth concerning reſidue life peraduenture men regard v may haue ſome regard thē verely muſt deſire prayſe deſire allowed creature receiue wage ſayth lord ieſus chriſt yet notwithſtanding let men ſee v reſt life pray vnto god euery man muſt retire ſhrinke himſelfe may acknowledge behold god behold throne maieſtie ſo doings life prayer muſt remoued furtheſt hypocriſie vntruth mean ill put vre let man marke howe hypocrite papacie play mockeholiday god ſhalbe ſtore liplabour thing wherein bewraye themſelues moſt though hypocriſie thing yet moſt al praiers papiſts ſide would god like conſideratiō haue ſpokē ſay euery v retired himſelf cōmeth praying vnto god locked vp behalf ſo reſpect world thē ſhould another maner perfectneſſe prayer thoſe haue feare god durſt ſo bold call vpon god name full mouth doe call vpon men ſeeming ynough world thinke haue good returne vnto god meane god ſeeth ſparke ſuch good furthermore although behoue v withdrawn ſelues pray vnto god ment cōmon prayer ſhould ſtirre vp one another example ſufficient euery man prayed chamber lodging god haue v pray togither cōmon one mouth end may one ſolemne confeſsion faith euery man may edified neighbor neuertheleſſe open praying muſt ſuch ſort may withdrawne ſelues euery man haue eye vpon god aboue thus muche concerning theſe wordes lifting vp oure handes zophar commeth downe ſecond table lawe ſayth must put away iniquitie handes must well houſes manner ſpeaking rife ynough ſay vve haue cleane handes hand meddle deale matter betwene v neighbor therefore robbeth neyghbor doth violence anoyance hathe foule hand like contrarie part ſaid childrē god waſh hand kepe equitie vprightneſſe ſo giue thēſelues miſdealing rather haue regard ſerue euery man turne zophars meening place man wil bliſſed god proſper muſt withhold hand vnrightfulneſſe driue away al vnrightfulneſſe hand haue called vpon god haue proteſted whoſe handes looke ſaluation welfare haue glorified becō meth v remaineth communicate neyghbors alſo without man wrong ſo mā may complaine haue put loſſe hinderāce cleere frō al violence guile liue neighbour maner behold god alſo draw neere vnto v thus ye ſee howe ſhall perceiue readie beſtow good thing vpon v deſire meete ſaluation foraſmuch men willingly beare thēſelues yea excuſe ourſelues euill ſeeke ſo many ſhifts ſtarting hole horrible behold ſayd miſdealing muſt chazed baniſhed tent ſay men muſt none euill directly ſo might caſt teeth ſhame alſo muſte beware none euill bee done vnder ſhadow exāple maſter houſehold let hold wife child ſeruants awe let take good heede wrong done man ouerthwart meanes wycked dealing thus yee ſee preciſely added miſdealing muſt dwell tentes haue wee effect ſayde remayneth euery one v thinke better haue done doctrine conſiſteth wordes muſt put vre euery mā euery v muſt thinke vpon throughly nothing heere ought cōmon familiar v ſo farre euen bycauſe parte v contented heare ſpeake yet notwithſtanding leaue chief point entent therefore may touched better quick let v marke firſt muſt go buſh god keepe right way ſhewed v ſaying drawe v ſuperſtitions fond ape toyes wherewith men beguile themſelues wilfully theſe general principle men finde hart confeſſe welynough namely good reaſon god ſhould honored ſerued without ſo curſe v caſt v away ought wonder though puniſh v conſume v aduerſities world ſeing worke ſpite againſt god muſt needes ouerwhelme v euery man ſay well confeſſe agayne ſeconde poynt bee denyed god haue pitie vpon v wee turne vnto wee ſerue ought hee deale ſo hardely v ſhall finde experience father sauiour v men well ynough ſay ſo commeth deede bee well perceyued nothing hypocriſie theſe goodly proteſtations men farre god ſo long thought content fonde fancy let v learne true turning whyche god alloweth tormenting mās ſelfe vayne ſuperfluous thing comming vnto rightmeening ſoundneſſe let v looke vppon lurkingholes harte ſay let euery man examine himſelfe let v flatter ſelues make ſelues beleeue blacke white ſhall winne nothing ſo seeyng haue ſo many ſtartingholes ſelues wee haue good cauſe fight againſt thē eaſie matter haue cleere hart ſuche ſoundneſſe god requireth vvhen men haue indeuered themſelues thervnto tyme much come middes iourney die yet neuertheleſſe muſt trauell ſtill deſire god ſtrengthen v wee may compaſſe intent power holy ſpirite marke ſpeciall poynt bringing heereof paſſe let v take heede bee angrie ſelues oft feele hypocriſie feynedneſſe ſelues euery man looked neerely himſelf certayne ſhould ſigh hundred time day whereas falne aſleepe yea mightely ſtoutly iuſtifie ſelues many would fayne haue men thinke ſeeke god pure freeharted affection apply indeuer therevnto yet meane ſearched themſelues throughly ſhould ſee men ſee would manifeſtly perceyued ful hypocriſie one drop good zele seeing worlde findeth ought rather finde themſelues beguyle themſelues wilfully euery v ſayd examine himſelfe ought certaine wee ſhoulde fall ſleepe rather wee ſhoulde pricked prouoked proceede right way let v make ſpeede god calleth v giueth v leaue boldneſſe ſtretch handes vnto let v abuſe ſuche benefite ineſtimable god preuented infinite goodneſſe gaue v way vnto v durſt preace vnto deede wee ſhould bee ſhaken diueliſh malapertneſſe man ſhould owne ſelfe owne head preace vntoo god hauing leaue god man durſt come neere mortall prince dead carkeſſe ſhall preace maieſtie oure maker yea verely conſidering wee mortall enemy wee cannot come thyther wee ſhall bring much ſinne bee hee muſte needes abhorre v reaſon thereof ſpiteth hym ſee v according alſo hee renounceth diſclaymeth v creature reſpect bee ſinners therefore muſt fayne giue v leaue call v tell v wee ſhalbe welcome open v gate behoueth v know needefull v bee dealt haue ſayde afore witte flee god refuge aſſuring ſelues wee deſtitute goodneſſe needie wretched may bee furthermore wee may well ſeeke heere wee lacke ſhall finde nothing emptineſſe oure ſelues ſo ſhalbe famiſhed ſuch weene ſupply theyr want ſeeking remedie handes creature doo feede themſelues winde let v go god ſeeke meane come lord ieſus chriſt make interceſsion v cauſe v finde fauour owne perſons god muſt needes hate v yea good right alſo holde v accurſed pleaſe fauorable v come name lord ieſus thing ſayde vnder lawe ſhadowes yet ſo darke ought wee bee muche affectioned adayes ſeeing veyle temple rente aſunder thys preſent doctrine ſerued time lawe people abode porch temple ſtoode aloofe veyle alſo hide thing ſight earneſtly ought practize day true high prieſt bare name child iſraell vpon ſhoulders vpon breſt behold ieſus chriſt hath rent aſunder veyle temple opened way ſuch wiſe wee may ſhewe oure ſelues god looke face way continually open hys bloud apoſtle ſayeth ſo buſſhes bramble let v nother way ſo rough ſo ſhrubbie wee ſhoulde bee faine leape ouer many lettes way altogither playn leuell ſo go bloud lord ieſus chriſt thus muche concerning poynt furthermore let v marke well alſo call vpon god purely ſhewing wee make true confeſsion faith yeelde due honour muſte alſo communicate neighbour maner vpright dealing neighbour made like vnto image god yet notwithſtanding fleece one eate vp another euery man giuen himſelfe pray ſpitte god far poſsible v worke anoyance thoſe ſhapen image neybours bee member ieſus chriſte wee offer wrong violence ſo haue eye owne profit renting ieſus chriſtes body peeces ſorte leade v god father make v find fauour lette v marke haue acceſſe vnto god wee muſt liue neighbour vpright dealing heere expreſſe mention made hand end ſhoulde knowe meane whereby god proueth maner chriſtianitie v euery man wil inable himſelfe tung none v al good ſeruant god wee may beleeued vpon woorde commeth deede man ſhall ſee cleane contrary hee hath preached charitie ſpoken maruellous well ſhew wholly giuen himſelfe cō meth point muſt ioyne neighbor good ſooth none ſo ſhameleſſe alwayes ſpeaking charitie haue bene accuſtomed haue ſo much charitie vſed towardes preach none thing man aske owe ſhal get none reaſon thē charitie charitie make remorſe pil poll men goodes liſt ſo blameworthy god man yet aſhamed preach charitie yea ſhall pilfer men goodes therefore expreſſe mention made hand behold true trial whither loue god honour becōmeth v making knowne vprightneſſe equitie v ſhort kindneſſe v ſo wee liue ſuch ſort neighbour euery one v according ſtate abilitie imploy himſelfe ſuccour thoſe haue neede intent meanes league aliance god hath ſet cōſecrated among v may obſerued thus ye ſee haue marke ſaide muſt caſt al iniquitie far hand one handycrafts man well let buſineſſe faithfully content himſelfe honeſt gaine worke hand let buyeth thinke thus himſelf muſt haue another man labour ſeeing brother trauels take payne reaſon ſhould loſe tyme otherwiſe one ſhoulde go plucke bread mouth god hath ſet hys ſuſtenance labour hand wrong much ſucked bloud whome god hath cōmended vnto whome bound releeue yee ſee euery man ought haue eye eſtate haue alleaged example end euery one v ſhould lay forth peecemeale according v haue deale neybours ſhould behaue ſelues ſuch wiſe wee might giue man occaſion complayne v furthermore alſo euery man ſhould haue eye hys owne houſehold god ynough faithful man forbeare euildoing directly himſelfe alſo haue al croked wayes farre v ſpecially haue care gouerne houſes god may honored childrē huſband wife maſter mēſeruants mayd ſeruants would god thought vpon better head houſe go aſtray haue feare god religiō ſeene al goeth wrecke child alſo honour father mother become better haue diſcretion ye ſhall ſee rooted naughtineſſe men maydens ſhalbe full corruptiō true mayſters miſtreſſes tel wel ynough finde fault ſeruants commit lewd prankes filche thing ſerue would haue meane god offended thouſand wayes make matter ſhal let ſlip much therfore behoueth v marke well haue ſaide namely muſt thinke content god carefull ſerue onely owne perſones wee muſt alſo haue eye thoſe whome haue charge keepe away euill wiſe aſſuring ſelues conſent vntoo wee muſt bee wrapped ſame damnation wicked ſo diligent take heede let v doubt god regard v mercie neere hande v wyth bliſsing grace according promiſed heere verily haue yet one poynt marke god fauour ſhewe ſelfe alwayes firſte brunt promiſes conteyned heere taken lawe leaſtwiſe ſame effect haue tolde wee knowe tyme booke written howſoeuer cace ſtande ſee ſpirite god ſpake ye ſee heere doctrine conformable whiche conteyned lawe moyſes lorde promiſeth bliſſe thoſe ſerue dwell among make perceyue howe auayleable hys preſence witte life ſhall happie lette v beare minde haue touched wit god maketh v feele hys fauour firſt puſh therefore whereas ſayd ſuch walke feare god ſhal bliſſed hee make proſper ment god viſiteth ſeruants ſuch wiſe ſeemeth bee alienated quite although call vpō muſt faine linger paine ſo wote ſeeming god hath vtterly forſaken muſt bee fayne walke world many affliction notwithſtanding wee ſerue god heerewithall haue double comfort one ſide certayne although hart tende vnto god yet notwithſtanding foraſmuch ſuch zele ought nother ſerue ſuch affection bound therefore muſt bee faine ſuffer puniſhment correction ſinnes yet meanes god maketh v conſider owne want wee mighte humble ſelues fall amendment returne vnto haue bin exerciſed ſort trouble hee ſendeth lo heere one great comforte bee made like vnto lord ieſus chriſte like hee entred kingdome heauen tribulation death euen ſo hys member beare markes troubled worlde end may cauſe v come glory reſurrection vve ſee oure aduerſities turned welfare heerewithall ought alſo comfore ſelues oure god put v triall knoweth meete behofefull v although wee muſt faine endure many want miſeries ſtate ſeeme bee wretcheddeſt worlde yet god ceaſſe make v feele continuallye hee neere v hathe forſaken v watcheth alwayes ouer v defende v ende wee ſeeke hande indeuoure ſerue honoure hym ſo pure right meening mynde vtterly voyde hypocriſie haue declared alreadie let v caſt ſelues downe good god father acknowledgement oure faultes ſinnes praying bring v backe vnto himſelfe much ſeeth ſuch vntowardneſſe nature oure thoughtes affection bent euill ſo nothing oure intentes vanitie leaſing may pleaſe reforme v ſuch wiſe wee may become newe ceatures wee knowing ſelues bee deſtitute goodneſſe maye ſeeke fauoure belongeth oure ſaluation yea bodyly life ſay wee maye ſeeke according office giue bountifully vnto v ſpecially name oure lorde ieſus chriſt gouerned ſpirite wee maye call vppon oure father therewithall bee ioyned knitte togither one true brotherly affection ſo wee maye declare thereby wee bee child wee growe true vnion charitie vntill beeing receyued heauenly heritage wee maye enioy true vnion whiche begonne alreadie v maye pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c xlv sermon first vpon twelfth chapter iob anſvvered ſaide 2 yea people vviſedome ſhall die vvith 3 haue vvit vvell vvhit inferiour vvho knovveth thing alledge 4 aieſting ſtocke friendes calleth vpon god vvhome heareth rightuous perfect skorned 5 torch deſpiſed rich man vvhoſe foote point ſlip 6 tent robber proſper hold god hand boldly prouoke ſeemeth firſt bluſhe theſe two ſayings namely ſuche feare god ſhall bliſſed wicked ſhall proſperitie cleane contrary deed iob anſwering wee haue heard witte deſpizers god lyue oftentymes eaſe gayneſayth propounded heeretofore zophar iobs anſwering contrarie hath bin ſaid ſhew doctrine although bee taken lawe neuertheleſſe miſapplyed therefore behoueth v conſider well howe vnderſtoode vvhereas god declareth auoucheth lawe hee keepe good vnder protection hee giue heart deſire ſhall want nothing themſelues cattell goodes ſhall bee bliſſed meeneth good ſhall neuer bee troubled pacience ſhould knowne riddeth hys ſeruants trouble thing ſhould fall mynde wee ſhould know call vppon god deſire pitie v nother ſhould wee feele goodneſſe reaching v hande let v marke well god hathe promiſed faythfull ſuche proſperitie world ſhould bee vtterly exempted ordinarie trouble wherevnto behoueth v bee ſubiecte ſuch promiſes god ſerue v vnderſtande commonly god make proſper whiche walke feare wee ſee howbeit waye wee haue theſe two poyntes marke witte oure ſynnes make v vnworthy god ſhoulde bliſſe v ſortes time man hee prouoketh god euen perfecteſt whome ſeeming fault founde euen rightuouſeſt doe finde themſelues blameworthy god therefore chaſtize hee doth iuſtly againe ſayd god doth alwayes meaſure affliction hee ſendeth ſinnes wee haue committed hee hathe reaſons viſite v namely hee mortifie euill v oftentimes god faine preuent vice lurke v although wee haue yet offended yet god ſee well wee fall ſome euill therefore ſteppeth afore remedie beſides hee intendeth humble v wee may put truſt world tied earth moreouer meeneth knowe whither wee obedient aduerſitie well proſperitie alſo purpoſeth know fayth whither wee flee refuge ſhorte make v haue eye kingdome heauen ende wee ſhould know oure welfare theſe two point well conſidered bee eaſie v conclude god bliſſeth ſuche keepe commaundementes ſendeth whatſoeuer hee knoweth bee behoofe yea appetite knowledge hee alwayes iudge furthermore ſcourge doth ſome cauſe ſame let feele hys fauoure goodneſſe continually haue whereof reioyce thus ye ſee howe promiſes preſent life taken god bindeth himſelfe handle v one indifferent rate effecte meening ſhewe wee ſhall perceyue bee fauourable neere hand ſuch seeing ſaide lawe wee ſhall liue peace reſt wee followe god lawe cauſe men vexe v trouble v haue made warre againſt god vvhen mortall man aduaunceth himſelfe againſt hys creator meete hee alſo ſhould haue enemy vexe anoy perſecuted men let v looke haue kept peace god let v conſider wee haue prouoked diſpleaſure therefore let v maruell thoughe hee giue men leaue vexe v ſort ſide heere ye ſee ſayd lawe god ſend warre vpon thoſe haue ſuch wiſe incountered furthermore although man purſue harme yet ceaſſe carrie hangman within among curſſes lawe ſayd alſo foreſt curſe ought abaſh v moſt thou ſhalt bee alwayes agaſt thou ſhalte haue thine eye ſunken thy heade thy lyfe ſhall hang vpon thread morning thou ſhalt ſay howe ſhall continue vntill night night thou ſhalte ſay warrant paſſe ouer night thou ſhalt continuall fearefulneſſe ſayth lorde behold rightfull puniſhment vpon ſuche framed meekeneſſe ſeruing god purely namely driuen bee owne tormenter let v marke well howe without cauſe lawe bliſsing giuen v ſhall liue peace man ſhall vexe v cleaue vnto god without gayneſaying god holde wicked ſhorte ſo ſhall bee able hurt v thoughe practize whatſoeuer againſt v let v marke alſo way although aſſayled outwardly pray yet neuertheleſſe muſt aſſure ſelues god defende v ſayd promiſe deceitfull howe nowe god ſticke ſuffer wicked ſpurre v gall v euen trie conſtancie alſo ſticke ſuffer v bee tempted mind ſo ſhall ſome doubt diſtruſt ende ſhould call vpon praye ſtrengthen v ſhall come paſſe yet meane tyme faythfull ſhall feele god caſt vppe middes trouble hand faythleſſe ſhall vtterly diſmayde ſo ende ſhall feele god hathe forſaken deſerue much bee ſayde reſidue bliſsings lawe ſhort oft troubled let v haue eye faultes humble ſelues god aſſuring ſelues chaſtizementes ſendeth rightfull deſirous hee ſhoulde aſſuage ſorrowes let v runne vnto let v ceaſſe miſdoing notwithſtanding haue ſayd alreadie muſt therfore imagin god holdeth one ordinarie meaſure puniſhing offender rate deſerte vve ſee chaſtizeth men worlde ſome ſome leſſe yea hee reſerueth many puniſhmentes laſte daye therefore wee muſte pronounce ſuche definitiue ſentence generall zophar hathe doone cauſe iob ſpeaketh againſt yea ſaythe hee people haue expounded ſentence though iob meante ſpoken brought nothing ſuche ſtuffe knowne men yea euen verie idiot cleane contrarie meening ſay ſeemeth whole world ſeemeth wiſdome ſhall dye thinke ye haue witte eſteeme yee vnderling thing yee alledge well knowne therefore muſt bee fayne bee deſpiſed call vpon god heard ſay ſuch god ſeemeth fauoure therefore agreeth wiſhe muſte bee fayne bee mockingſtocke ſuch folke muſt bee fayne bee torch waſteth deſpized rych ſhort hold god hand ſayth hee doe boldly ſpite prouoke whyle tentes wicked vnthriftes proſper heereby iob ſheweth howe great follie affyrme generally without exception god dothe thys preſent life puniſhe ſuche haue offended ſoone man hath doone amiſſe god redreſſeth hath hande vp take ſuche vengeance partie hathe deſerued vvee ſee cleane contrarie ſayd afore ſeemeth repugnant doctrine lawe ſayd god curſe tranſgreſſers commaundementes hee ſhewe fauoure goodneſſe towardes thoſe keepe men ſee hauockmakers fauoured hande men ſee good deſpiſed diſquieted vvhat meante godieſt promiſeth bliſſe faithfull pronounced ſuche curſe vpon deſpiſers word haue alreadie loozened knot ſhewing god executeth iudgementes one rate world vvee muſt alwayes beare mynde hath bene ſayd heretofore witte god ſhould puniſhe thoſe haue doone amiſſe like like ſaye ſo faulte great puniſhment ſhould bee anſwerable fault light chaſtizement ſhould ſuddeine vpon good ſhould dealt heart deſire whereto ſhould comming oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſerue reſurrection wee waite ſhould hope would conclude beholde god ſheweth himſelfe bee iudge world let doe well liſteth hee receiue well god hande would anye heauenly life ſhould haue heauen heere wee ſee god ſhould prouide yll oure welfare ſhould make puniſhmentes like offence amiſſe therefore requiſite diuerſe yea moſt part puniſhmentes ſhould reſerued vvhen god puniſheth wicked well make v walke feare warineſſe alſo ſheweth v eſcape hande iudgeth without reſpect perſons muſt conclude faultes committed day abyde vnpuniſhed reſpecte thys preſente lyfe ſhall come accounte ende witte great aſſyſes hild lo iob ſpeaketh againſt doctrine lawe againſte falſe expoſition giuen zophar woulde god ſhoulde preſently make ſuche execution iudgementes hee ſhoulde leaue faulte vnfounde oute wee neede wayte anye dooyng falleth oute ſo hathe bene ſhewed afore heereby wee bee taught praye god giue v ſpirite wiſedome may apply well oure owne vſe doctrine true good ſo may haue skill take profite heere ſee doctrine verie profitable edifying god ſheweth v ſerue ſhall looſe laboure hee mainteine v continually make v perceyue life throughout thing ſhould thinke god regardeth v ſeruice ſlippeth away without regarde part therefore wee muſt come whiche eſay ſayth bee yee contented rightuous ſhall receiue hyre otherwiſe would betyde v dauid confeſſeth happened vnto namely hee good ſlidden awaye foote ſlipped poynt fall bene vpon yee ſuche time hee thought waſhing hys handes innocencie ſeruing god bene vaine muſt wee vnderſtande god watcheth ouer worlde hee knoweth bee ſeeke ſerue honoure alſo hee hath eye vpon wicked ſayd pſalme ſo ende muſt needes ſhewe beare ſo great contempt grace meane ſeaſon let v tarrie god leyſure till hee ſende iudgementes due time v haſten great doltiſhneſſe would haue god puniſh faultes ſuch prouoke wrath preſently ſone toy taketh v head yea verely delay till another time v abridge libertie behold ſayd haue neede praye god giue v ſpirite wiſedome ende may take ſayde texte lawe owne imagination wee maye bee good expounder ſo wee doe zophar doth heere concludeth ſuche ſerue god muſte rewarded hand prenſent lyfe muſt paradiſe thē god muſt bee fauourable world may ſee ſhewe verie deede doth ſo ſaith iob vvhy ſo ye ſee wicked proſperitie prouoke god ſo much boldly sith cace ſtandeth ſo experience ſheweth v god execute iudgementes hande holdeth couert ſuſpence vntill houre hee thinketh good meane whyle good chyldren god euen haue walked ſingle meaning heart may ſcourged extremely yet muſt bee imputed ſinnes though furtheſt ſquare men ſo ſhould ſayde suche man puniſhed rigorouſly therefore muſt concluded hee heynous offender god abhorreth ſo god knowes wherfore ſcourgeth good hee hath diuerſe reaſons v giue ſentence v ſaye man hathe ſinned greeuouſly others ſeeing god vſeth ſuche roughneſſe towards thus yee ſee howe muſt reſtrayne promiſes threatnings lawe god prouidence curſſe thereof ſuche wee ſee bee daily threatnings god true hee ſayth curſſe tranſgreſſers yea hee executeth firſt day god muſt workes pleaſeth ſelfe ſuch proportion meaſure hee knowes conuenient god promiſeth bliſſe thoſe ſerue walke according yea yet hee haue authoritie afflicte euen welfare ſaluation hee ceaſſeth bee alwayes neere hande heare neede make perceyue profitable affliction yet time plunged ouer head eares bee toſſed fro ſo wote become good bee meekened welfare lo howe god ſoothfaſt promiſes threatnings yet gouerneth worlde ſuche wiſe prouidence ſeemeth godly haue loſt laboure ſeruing wicked haue bridle layd looſe necke skoffe god ſcaped hande ſeeme v iudge wee ſee preſently according wee meaſure thinges oure owne witte let v humble ſelues ſay vvell god iudge world howbeit appeereth firſt blow therefore howe cloſe ſoeuer keepe himſelf yet neuertheleſſe wee muſte haue fayth hope v conclude thing whiche vnknowne v ſhalbe ſhewed v end let v come iobs word ſet downe heere bee people wiſedome ſhall dye heereby hee meant repreſſe fooliſh haughtineſſe preſumption haue ſpoken otherwiſe dealing ſuch ſo puffed vp vayne truſte theyr owne skill men muſt needes ſhew follie true oftentimes men ſhall nothing auayle ſo dooing hee throughly ſotted owne fonde ouerweening ſo euer man tell neuertheleſſe bee wedded owne opinion take himſelfe yet notwithſtanding wee incounter againſt ſuche miſwreſt god truth wee muſt ſticke ſhewe follie ignorance verely may bee done though men would ſhewe whither ſharpwitted better skill beholde ſo doe haue nothing ambition vaineglorie euery would faine make great ſhew hee beginneth would faine amaze men talke anſwereth would alſo aduaunce himſelfe well yee ſee battell fooles wee muſt deale ſort therefore wee incounter corrupte god truth wreſt vnto vntruth come ſhewe ignoraunce vvee muſt doe ſeeme better learned skilfuller purchaze ſelues eſtimation wee muſte content ourſelues haue made waye truth may receyued men longer wedded ſuche bee reputation ouerthrowe well builded day man ſhall ſee many poore ſillie folke hilde ſtill ſuperſtitions bycauſe ſay many great learned men haue hild doctrine followed nowe adays ſtand ſtill ſame houre beguiled beholde poynt many poore weakiings bycauſe poſſeſſed imagination poſsible prelate church learned men great perſonages ouerſeene nowe teach ſuch folke make come knowledge god requiſite learne knowe beaſtlineſſe ignorance thoſe whome haue eſteemed ſo highly lift vp ſelues againſte god theſe ſuperſtitious hipocrites doe whiche mainteyne abhominations papacie day ſhould conuicted beaſtlineſſe malapart ſo euer yet ſo doltiſh euen little babe may perceiue gewgawes told rage men ſo true haue skill ynough loth god truth ſhould meanes come neere ſimple ſort ſuch alreadie ſnarled ſaide falſe opinion ſpake yee ſee wiſe iob rebuketh heere euill expounder god lawe ſuch wreſted ſtraunge meening telleth great clearkes would faine ſeeme alledged thing purpoſe thing ought bee knowne men finally hee mocketh ſaying bee whole people wiſedome ſhall dye wyth vvhen iob ſayth inferioure haue hearte witte well meeneth magnifie hymſelfe thereby maner haue tolde fonde vaingloriouſneſſe euery man ſhoulde owne ſide bee deſirous ſhewe ſelfe cunning ſharpwitted others hee ſhould ſaye vvhat pray verely much bickering among men yet god truth ſhall continue ſtill iob meeneth heere ſhewe god hath giuen grace know diſcerne truthe better ſo full ouerweening ſo yee ſee wiſe may bee lawefull v boaſte ourſelues ende men ſhould clap handes v great learned men men great witte knowledge awaye theſe fonde toyes vnpoſsible v ſettle mind ſeruing god excepte wee forget euer concerneth ſelues long haue eye ſelues couet eſtimation certaine oure lorde ſuffer v fall many ouerſightes become laughingſtocke oure vtter ſhame heere ye ſee alſo hire ſuche couet bee eſtimation good reaſon ſhould bee ſo ſeeing god truth thereby layde flat vpon ground meane whyle men haue regard owne honoure vvhat done vve muſt forget ſelues yet ſo therewithall aduaunce god gracious giftes namely ende haue good cace ſame may mainteined thing ſhall alledge may receyued authoritie man bee taken idiot haue nother skill witte become nothing ſpeaketh receiued diſdayne man intende fare better aughte ſpoken muſt thinke thus himſelfe well god hathe giuen ſome grace man ſame grace deſpiſed ſhould wrong vnto god bycauſe proceedeth holie ghoſt sith ſo let v beware wee lifte vp ſelues againſte god thus ye ſee howe cauſe humbly receiue good doctrine know man teacheth v hath bene taught god lo intent iob declareth hee witte whit inferioure thoſe ſet ſo great price eſtimation ſelues bee ſhorte let v learne aduaunce gracious giftes god hathe put v yea verelie exalt ourſelues intent thing haue receiued may profite bring forth fruite thus much concerning perſon iob heerewithall alſo faithfull warned ſee man hath receyued excellent gift holie ghoſt ſo able aduaunce god honoure edifye church muſt giue eare muſt bee receyued reuerence hee ſhall ſaye vvhyſo otherwiſe diſpiſing god let v come iob ſaith ſaith despiſer frundes true word lie ſaith deſpized frinds forſaken deed ſpeaketh himſelf third perſon afterward likeneth himſelfe torch linke waſteth ſhunned vvhat man looke torch commeth ende waxe droppeth men drawe backe ray light vpon ynough marre garment therefore linke torch hath lighted men time ſerued men long caſt away euery man ſhunnes nothing ſtinch iob meaneth ſaying cace ſtoode euen ſo himſelfe yee ſee readie fall ſayth hee therfore yee deſpize hee ſheweth reaſon ſimilitude ſaying bycauſe yee ſee brim graue cauſe forſaken hee ſayth alſo rich men doe mocke afflicted call vpon god ſaith hee heareth iob meaneth heereby wicked wayte welfare god hand ſeeke meaneth haue world ſo ſeemeth haue god hand carie ſleeue men ſay according wee ſhall ſee hee addeth afterwarde true ſome expounde ſentence bee meant idolater make god come handes fooliſh vnreaſonable expoſition iob loked proſperitie wicked haue al welfare cōmeth god wicked haue abundance mē doth ſeem god league thē ſotheth thē yeldeth himſelf luſt man might properly ſay god flattereth liue ſo reſte proſper ſuche wiſe haue ſhortely whatſoeuer deſire iob ſayth thoſe mē prouoke god ſo much boldly yet mean houſes happie vvhereby hee ment betoken haue told afore witte zophar wrong ſaying great ſinner vvherefore ſayth hee contrary bee ſeene let v come ſayth concerning contempt deſpiſed ſayth linke teach waſted heere perſon iob wee taughte lord giueth world leaue skorne v ſuffereth ſtate ſo miſerable ſeemeth vtterly forlorne therefore behoueth v pacient vvhy ſo vve ſee befell vnto iob would deere seeing ſo excellent ſeruant god ſo giuen vp men mocked tooke caſtaway let v aſtoniſhed murmure againſt god hee ſuffer v come ſame poynt nother let v thinke ouercruell handling v ſo let v conſider howe good v meekened ſort let waken v let v learne hope muſt rooted beneath faſtned ſure ankerhold heauē apoſtle ſaith great leſſon whē mockages world ordeyned ſaluation true ſuch laughter ſhall end • long face wicked dofling v meane ſeaſon profitable v ſayde make v regard god know hope lieth conſiſteth wholly thus ye ſee haue remember ſayde laughed skorne thoſe haue bin friend verely greeuouſeſt temptation haue loued v heretofore wer abhorre v hard digeſt ſeeing beſell vnto iob let v follow ſteps ſtoupe god liſteth abace v ſorte hee ſayth expreſſely foote ſlid meening ſo long able ſtand bin torch link man eaſe haue burning torche light ſeruice yea ſo long whole able laſt bee waſted man wyll caſt away intoo canell beareth muſt needes burne handes remayneth nothing little glimcing darke ſmoke iobs intent ſhewe time god hild hym vp hee honored eſteemed nowe hee falne hee caſt away heereby warned ſometimes may foreſpent ſo men ſhall ſee light v ſhall nothiug lefte little ſmoke ſeeme ſhall fall peeces ſhall whole peece left v ſhall come laſt caſt let v take paciently foraſmuch iob came ſame point v ſeeing hath ſhewed v path let v follow hym pray god ſtrengthen v ſuch wiſe wee may vtterly decay touching ſaying deſpiſers god call vpon heareth haue told already referred common perceuerance men ſeemeth wicked couenant god obteyne whatſoeuer liſt hand true verieſt hipocrits looceſt liuers deede cal vpon god howbeit way mockerie ſay god would giue ſuch thing vvhen wicked man deſirous rob another mā goodes prayes hart god would giue ſuch man goodes praying vnto god diſguiſing ſtayning maieſtie ſhort men ſtarke mad whē aſhamed mocke god ſort wrapping ſinnes curſed kayti • e yet farre ſquare deſires wold fayne haue god intermedle ſelfe right calling vpon god name among wicked nother true prayer thus ye ſee bee taken iob ſayth heere foraſmuch wicked deſire liſt receiue god hand ſeemeth god hearkneth ſay ſeemeth willing graunt theyr luſts way let v marke wicked deſire god whatſoeuer hearte wiſheth yea euen without reuerēce faith lawfull forme prayer caſting foorth auenture inordinate deſire greater damnation vvherfore nature teacheth v ought reſort vnto god want verely wicked neuer bethink themſelues aforehand ſaye god muſt honored hande hee holdeth welfare welth hand fountayne thereof thence muſt draw therefore reaſon ſhould craue lowlineſſe wicked skill yet doth god thruſt forward blind motion ſo cōſtreyned know god whoſe hand wee muſt demaund wee want according ſee ſay wold god wold giue ſuch thing haue knowledge ingrauen hart maketh thē ſo much guiltie god diſhonoring holye name ſort mingling outrageouſe deſires horrible wiſhes heereby wee bee warned wee pray vnto god wee muſt doo reuerence calling vpon full beleefe rooted hart wretched nothing remedie miſeries calamity except wee flee refuge meere goodneſſe gracious god pleaſe giue v goodes hath hād iob ſayth tent wicked ſhall peace verely ſayth bycauſe hold god make come handes yet euen thoſe ſame prouoke boldly behold whereof commeth contemptuouſneſſe vnbeleeuers cauſe wicked contented vaunt themſelues though god fauored alſo proudely cruelly trample thoſe vnder feete walke ſingly vprightly ſaying ſeemeth thē god exalting end ſhould deſpiſe others ſhake heere ye ſee temptation troubleſom hard ouercome ſo much ſtandeth v hand marke well texte let v vnderſtande newe cace wicked adayes aduaunced raunge abrode triumph time hath always bin ſo god ſuffereth greater decay ſuffereth alſo meeken v wicked happen haue theyr full ſcope let v loſe courage let v ſerue god ſtedfaſtly let v glory hope hath giuen v laſting life notwithſtanding ſuffer v combered wee bee miſcaried wee ſee god aduaunce naughtipacks ſet aboue cloudes bee ouerthrowne thereby continue alwayes ſure ſtedfaſt oure vocation beholde good warrant faith alſo ſayd afore namely good profitable god ſhould trie v ſort ſame happeneth wee ought thinke ſtraunge conſidering hath bin ſo iobs time thoſe make god come intoo hand euen thoſe prouoke moſt malapartly maner ſpeech betokeneth god fauoreth loueth wicked certeſſe ſo iudge according fleſh cauſe ſay god loueth al thoſe haue proſperitie neuertheleſſe proſperitie wicked haue world deſtruction ruine bicauſe god ſide although ſeeme fauoured hand bee deere derlings yet end ſhall perceiue euer haue ſhal turned deſtruction ſide although god ſeeme ſhrinke v make countenance help v ſeemeth bee ſeparated v yet let v learne ſay let v learne humble ourſelues vnder mightie hand ſubmit ſelues good follow word waiting till ſhew effect always neere hand v meane let faith continue alwayes true ſtedfaſtneſſe although god plague v let v weerie ſeruing let v hold race continually till haue made v paſſe incounters temptation haue indure world let v fall downe face good god acknowledgment fault praying make v feele ſuch wiſe may come ſubmit ſelues vnto ſtand vppon defence oure owne righteouſneſſe ſound dealing yeeld ſelues giltie deſire vſe infinite mercie towards v foraſmuch hee hath alreadye ſhewed v way whereby muſt come vnto witte bringing vnto obedientneſſe oure lord ieſus chriſt meane thereof fault may buried forgottē may pleaſe receiue v ſaid name forgiue ſinnes alſo gouerne v ſuch wiſe holy ſpirite may always get vpper hand euen till oure liues ende yea euen ouer death ſelfe ouer temptation diuell able raiſe may pleaſe hym graunt grace c xlvj sermon ſecond vpon twelfth chapter 7 aske cattell vvill teach thee aske foules aire vvill tell thee 8 ſpeake earth vvill informe thee fiſhes sea vvill report thee 9 vvho knovveth theſe thing hand god hath done 10 vvhoſe hand ſoule breath liuing thing 11 doth eare diſcerne vvords roofe mouth ſauoure vittells 12 vviſdome old men age bringeth skilfulneſſe 13 vviſdome ſtrength counſell skilfulneſſe 14 vvill throvv dovvne man ſhall able build vp▪ vvill ſhut vp man ſhall able let 15 vvill reſtrayne vvaters ſhall drie vp hee vvill ſende foorth ſhall ouerflovv earth 16 hath ſtrength might commeth deceyued deceyuer ſhewe nothyng meere ambition vaynglory zophar ſayde hym iob telleth hee knowth well god prouidence importeth gouerning whole worlde manifeſt doctrine ſo man needed haue made ſo great proteſtation thing ment propounde theſe ſaith knowē thing yea great follie zophar thinke himſelf haue great witte magnifying god prouidēce ſorte iob therefore ſheweth geere common ordinarie ynough▪ afterward ſeconde poynte hee declareth hee wondered friend better vnderſtand matter hee diſcourſed afore vvhereto ſerueth ſayth haue eares eate drinke palat well ynough diſcerne foode whither bee ſauery therefore like palat giuē man taſt thing eateth ſo eares ſerue heare word ſeemeth ye deafe haue heard nothing thus much ſecond poynt thirdly ſaid mā ſeeke true wiſdome muſt ſtay vpon men vpon creature ſayth whome al wiſdome bycauſe bin vpbraided afore voutſafed inquire auncients regarded time paſt yea ſaith beleeue muſt hold ſelfe altogither vnto men wiſdome vaniſheth away vve muſt rather go vnto god muſt ſeeke ſure ſtay haue reſt vpon ſhall always māmering vntill wiſe taught ſchole wee muſt vnderſtande euer ſhall haue ſhewed v ſhal nothing compariſon infunite wiſdome referred behird proofe hereof hee caſt downe man ſhall build vp liſt ſhut vp man keepe hym priſon man may deliuer let v vnderſtand wiſdome god ouerhigh ſecret v verely ſaith vnto belong bee beguileth beguiled hee ſhould ſaye god ſende ſpirit erroure ſtraunge thing ſuch one thinke hard ſo blind thoſe ought keepe themſelues beguiling ſhall vtterly blockiſh cōmeth paſſe without maketh v oure wit end therfore muſt conclude high wiſdome v atteyne great ſecretes god iudgemēts meening ſaith ende debate heere vain vve ſee effect iobs word howbeit wee may receiue good inſtruction ſentēce let v marke firſt iob meneth god glory doth ſuch wiſe ſhine whole world euery creature wee ſuch diſcretiō wee ought haue ſame ynough make v learned vvhat cauſe become ſo brutiſh know belongeth god much ſay marke altogither viſible open ſight man excuſe hymſelfe ſay clerk neuer went ſchoole yea verely ye neede learne brute beaſts earth ſpeechleſſe fiſhes dumb teach v god giue v ſome vnderſtanding become ſtarke dolt therefore muſt conclude ther none let owne vnthankfulneſſe vouſaf opē eye ſee thing god ſheweth v behold text well worth marking place holy ghoſt telleth v god glory ſhews itſelfe euery ſaid heauens tell foorth goodly order ſee betwene day night ſtarres wee behold sky al reſidew vnto v liuely picture god maieſtie good faith although ſtarres ſpeake yet euē holding peace crie ſo loude ther ſhall nede none witneſſe againſt v latter day bicauſe haue taken heede hath bin ſhewed v ther ye ſee haue beare mind according alſo paul ſaith firſt chapter romanes wheras god inuiſible himſelf hath vttered himſelf opēly ynough cretures intēt ſhuld left without excuſe ſaid act apoſtles hath left himſelf without witneſſe crieth lowde ſhril creature al goodnes cōmeth god haue created world al hād vnder ſubiectiō pray reaſon ſhould homage whē wee hold life wholly needeth hee make anye long proces condemne v oure naughtineſſe common haue denied obedience due maker labored plucke ſelues away frō ſted honoring ſpited vice corruptiōs seing thē al notoriouſly knowē vtterly confounded therefore let v remēber well ſaid namely ther excuſe ignorance left men go alledge knew god high thing attein vnto vvhy go ſchole beaſts wold ſufficiēt teacher thē ther nother aſſe oxe could teach v god is▪ beſts create thēſelues doth mē ſee welynough ſaid god made al thing cōſider end namely hath applied vſe doth ſhew boūd vnto excedingly vvhat thing hath giuē v aboue al creaturs seing hath ſhewed himſelf ſo bountifull towards v meete powring rich ſhould caſt thē mire reaſon ſhuld ſet ſtore goodnes hath made v feele thē cōpariſon make betweene ourſelues beaſts ought right bring v ſo far worſhip ſerue god according diſcerning good euil hath ingraued heart retchleſneſſe dulneſſe vnthākfulneſſe ſo burie thing oftentimes ſeene beſts haue witte reaſon haue true ſaid beſts teach v example bicauſe haue behold glory god thē furthermore haue touched alredy beaſts ſhew v duety duetie better thereby cōdemned double alſo thing whervnto prophet eſay ſendeth v aſſe ſaith knoweth maſters ſtable oxe knoweth owner crib people knoweth vve ſay wee bee god church houſe could find hart aduanced higher ſaith church make himſelfe bee herd voice ſoundeth high cleere yet al know wherof cōmeth wit reaſon oxe aſſe thā mortal men vvherfore hath giuē v reaſon yea haue bin taught word wil vtter peruerting god goodneſſe vve ſee thē fort men may rebuked exāple beaſts whē ſlouth ful dſcharging duetie godward ſaide turneth double cōfuſiō text iob ment creature ſufficiētly teach v ought honour god let v opē eye ſaith vve neede learned haue great capacitie cānot caſt eye vpward downward god preſēteth himſelf al ſides ſort haue told glory viſible throughout thing wherin conſiſteth god glory power goodneſſe wiſdome iuſtice vve ſee god hath ſet world good order ye ſee wonderfull wiſdome whereat ought rauiſhed infinite power god mainteineth preſerueth thing hath made whole vphild hys full ſtate may well ſeeme impoſsible thing ye ſee ought reuerēce god mighty power alſo goodneſſe wherfore hath made world vvherefore hath ſtuffed ſuch rich vvherefore hath ſo decked vtter loue ſpecially mercie towards men according ſaid pſalmes extendeth hys mercie euen vnto beaſtes ſhall betide v much neerer whome hath put much nobleneſſe without compariſon ye ſee god goodneſſe ſheweth declareh ſelfe vve ſee hys righteouſneſſe watcheth ouer creature careth therewithall ſide ſee alſo iuſtice ſee gouerneth world wonderful faſhion ſo although wicked ſeeke nothing elſe bite yet muſt bee fayne confounded therefore let v learne applie indeuoure better beholding god work vvhen ſunne ſhineth let v cōſider god kindleth light end ſhould led guided vnto beholding heauen earth thing conteyned ſhould homage benefites hee beſtoweth vppon v nothing myght hinder v marking conſidering throughly lo god would haue v comprehend wee atteine vttermoſt depth wiſdome deepe gulfe yet behoueth v diligente indeuoure may prooue good ſcholers god ſchoole according abilitie ſo doutleſſe ſhall latter day bee caſt oure teeth wee haue conceyued verie beaſtes dumb witleſſe creature haue ſhewed v angel heauen ready declare god wil ſame hath bin witneſſed v prophet apoſtles ſpecially lord ieſus chriſt fare better excuſe ſhall make although bereft holy ſcripture doctrine yet notwithſtanding euen thynges beaſts ſhew v ynough condemne v bereeue v excuſe intent caſt teeth laſt day wee haue wilfully ſhut eye god would haue drawen v vnto offered himſelfe familiarly vnto v end ſhould haue knowen let v bethinke v better matter haue done heeretofore let v follow warning iobs aske beaſts wil anſwer thee talke earth ſhew thee bird aire informe thee fiſhes ſea haue skill tell thee yea though bee neuer ſo dumb thus much concerning ſentence let v come ſecond point iob alledgeth heere palat ſaith • rieth tast vittels eare diſcerneth word hereby findeth fault friend letting thing paſſe ſpoken afore voutſafed conſider wherevnto tended bin deafe iob blameth ſuche retchleſneſſe matter pointeth v proofe heere let v marke quicke taſt haue diſcern foode euery v hath skill ſay good haue good appetite oure palat alſo reſt ſenſes ſuttle mough wee ſpie thing delighteth v eye neuer wee haue mind go runne whither ſpare nother hand leg ſhort man wil ſharp witted ynough yea ouerſharp witted al thing like fleſh contentation fooliſh luſts hee commeth iudging doctrine might ſoule helth whereby ſhould receiue edifying ſuch dullard ſeemeth blockes wood whereof commeth ſo doltiſh bycauſe beſtowe whole witte ſuch wiſe requiſite wee ſhould moreouer eares ſhew keepe egall meaſure man tell v fooliſh tale vtter lewde talke poyſon infect v sainct paule ſaythe wee haue eares attentiue man needeth tell v one thyng twice wee vnderſtand incontinent wee come hungrie appetite ſuch thing ſo wee cannot bee ſatiſfied fond thing trifling toyes thing hurtfull wicked ye ſee wherevnto man caſteth ſelfe altogither meane ſeaſon god tell v thing good edifye v wee fare prophet eſay ſayeth man tell v thing two three time yet let ſlip away perceiue prophet eſay likeneth thoſe ſo vnluſtie dulheaded bycauſe god bereueth witte reaſon naughtineſſe ſake vntoo little babe whome folke ſay rightly man hath told fower fiue time well harped vpon perchance ſay man aske letter know awhit afterward one come b b long man pronouncing letter ſay b man aske anone letter forget prophet eſay ſaith man muſt faine repeate thing ſuch ſorte thoſe haue profited god ſchoole hee muſt chaw euery worde euery ſillable yet neuer wiſer nother thing euer ſinke intoo head euen ſo fare alſo vvherefore let v marke well holy ghoſt mouth iob heere doth blame thoſe three men alſo condemne v al ſo attentiue heare thing belong bodily life behalfe man needeth tarrie till haue bin ſchoole become clerk euery man maſter doctor owne pleaſure profite ſay come well purpoſe mine owne tooth incontinently wee haue concluded vppon matter neede long perſwaſions much leſſe long talke matter wee preuent altogither vpon ſpurre nothing nimble witte applyed fond thing wee come god doctrine wee bee worſe beaſts whereof commeth mouth iudge foode god doctrine ſhall haue ſauoure v vvee taſt inſomuch wee cannot diſcerne betweene truth vntruth let v marke laſt day ſhall neede none thing confound mankynde article haue bin ſo much giuen worldly thing leyſure giue eare thing wer euerlaſting welfare ſoules wee haue heere degenerated brute beaſtes reaſon wittes haue bin tangled either rich pleaſures vanity wicked affection looke vpon man coueteth goodes world vvhat man ſhall beguile one penie hee always reckenings counting vppon nothing ſcapeth hym without looking may gayne ſayth hee hys mind wandreth abrode aduentureth trudgeth vp downe whence cōmeth ſuch wittneſſe bycauſe man affection leades carry away ſuch wiſe knoweth vve ſee much thoſe labour come eſtimation ſet themſelues credite dignitie thoſe alſo gather meanes poſſible aduaunce haue reaſons alledge ſelues ſides yea euen whoremonger caried away beaſtly luſt drunkardes ſwine haue skilfulneſſe kinde taſt manner may compaſſe wickedneſſe ſhall become v wee haue wit come home vnto god doth happen bycauſe hold skorne vſe thing god hath giuen v ſayd afore heere yet one accuſation againſt men ſee many adayes think themſelues haue faire ſtarting hole knowe nothing god caſt doctrine vnder foote ſay ſee pray ye notable iudge man may beguile vnder coloure god religion therefore better know nothing yea vnthankfulneſſe god hath giuen v eares heare obediently ſay make ſeeking matter one man ſhoulde ſay eate euill meates man might giue naughtie weede woulde poyſon mee therefore better eate meate man ſhould make ſo fooliſh determination himſelfe woorthy ſtarue lo deale ſay know holy ſcripture may deceiued vvretched creature thou art foode thy ſoule lord nouriſheth men body meate drinke nurriſheth ſoules word yet wee would refuze foode feare ſome corruption manifeſt tempting god ſayd wherefore eares giuen v heare herken receiue whatſoeuer god ſayth vnto v true ſelues ſhall bee able except god enlighten v yet wee come meekely heare tolde v name god wee deſire gouerne v holy ſpirit may abuſed vntruth hee ſhewe hath made eares nought heare receyue told v feare reuerence thus yee ſee wee haue marke thys ſtreyne ſo effect holy ghoſt exhorteth v herken vnto god ſpeaketh v diligent receiuing doctrine ſaluation doubting make preuaile v wee haue oure eares ready well diſpoſed heare ſayth let v come iob addeth vviſdome olde men age bringeth skilfulneſſe wiſdome skilfulneſſe counſell altogither heere iob maketh compariſon betweene god men poynt whereof hee bin accuſed hee regarded tyme paſt conſidered thing antiquitie bare mind bin taught ſuche liued long time world heerevpon ſaith yea verely wiſdome old men truly may taken way mockerie thus alledge mee auncient time old men end ſhoulde hold ſhall become god muſt god bereft honoure men may take roome iob graunteth may ſome wiſdome men ſo beit exalted aboue meaſure hee ſhould ſay true man haue liued long time heere ſeene muche hee may haue gotten ſome skill muſt ſame derogation god wiſdome men vanitie although deſerue eſteemed ſelfe compariſon made betwixt men god euer haue muſt needes daſhed downe god muſt reputed wiſe men muſt knowe wiſedome thus ye ſee iobs meening haue good profitable leſſon gather ſentence firſt certayne ought deſpiſe wiſdome men whome god ſendeth v helpes folke haue ſeene much god intendeth teach v wee holde skorne profite ſelues ſhew v whome wee offer wrong euen liuing god alſo god haue giuen man good wit ſo able giue counſell aduice giue abilitie grace teach others folke make account refuſe certayne holy ghoſt trampled vnder foote man able inſtruct v hath himſelfe owne growing giuen aboue giuen helpe v withall god dealeth foorth gift ende euerye man ſhould keepe himſelfe make men partner common edifying v ſo ſtately cannot abide bee taught thoſe haue good doctrine guided thoſe giue good counſel ſo quēch light god refuſe benefite would beſtow vpon v therefore wee haue men able teach v muſt willingly heare yeeld ſelues teachable meeke mind bee ſtubborne ſee part yet muſt wee hold ſelues poynt altogither without exception vve ſee wretched world blinded day ſayd credit giuing ſo much men wil ſay vvhat manner liuing men vſe adayes time mind vvhat long time haue men kept themſelues hath bin vſed thus long time heerevppon wretched folke caſt themſelues intoo deſtruction god ready bring right way according wee ſee word preached v intent ſhould haue full authoritie ouer v might led ſnare deceitfull word sainte paule ſayth fourth epheſians mē ſhould leade v lure god mighte gouerne v become wiſe obeying ye ſee way haue hold wee haue receyued men hand thing bring god miniſters inſtruments holy ſpirite vve muſt neuertheleſſe vnderſtand god muſt haue whole preheminence ouer v whome wiſdome proceedeth end caried away truſting much vnto men bee toſſed ſuddainly hither thither may bee fully ſettled certaintie hold doctrine better perceyuing heereof muſt note two extremity ſhall ſee ſome brainleſſe perſons deſpiſe gift god giueth men vnskilfulleſt preſumptuouſeſt cace common thing ſo muche brag theyr beaſtlineſſe looke vpon man neuer knowledge thinke hath ſo much cauſe ſtand vpon reputation wee ſee diuers adayes wreſt text ſcripture aduaunce themſelues greater pride ye ſee ſayd god hydeth ſecrets wiſe men greate men world openeth little one yet ſome beaſtes yet glory though diuinitie god men ſhould vaunt themſelues theyr ſlenderneſſe deſpiſe gift deſerue eſteemed vvhēce come ſciences vvhēce commeth diſcretion one man another riuers flowing one fountaine witte ſpirit god yes vndoutedly let v learne deſpiſe god gift appeere men profit ſelues applye owne vſe wee refuſe men without diſcretion surely great folly men ſay fooles bolt ſoone ſhot double fooles wee iudge without anye knowledge diſcretion yet ſee many ſuch diuerſe ſay thing hilde obſerued yea ther reaſon howbeit foraſmuch commeth men refuze nay canſt thou tell whither ſuch thing came firſt god meanes men therefore man layeth doctrine v muſt ſo ſwift haſtie refuze wee muſte ſift thus ye ſee modeſty muſt vſe eſchue extremitie ſpake alſo extremitie touched witte ſame ſee papiſts behold ſay holde whiche hath bin taught childhod follow father aunceſters antiquitie ſhall god forgo authoritie meane muſt men aduanced ſo high god ſhould thruſt vnder feete vvere better ſunne plucked skie throwne bottome ſea behold heere greater outrage ouſe confuſion therefore let v keepe ſelues well offering ſuche outrage vntoo god leaue behind v hold ſelues wholly vnto men receiuing whiche commeth men god giueth v meanes muſt bee ſuch ſort god may always haue whole due hee may exalted great ſmall may taught may proteſt teachablneſſe towards men ſerueth abate whit god duetie hys ſoueraintie hath ouer v guide v vntoo ſtop mouthes ſpeaketh ſo wee may hold peace bee hindred leade v whither liſteth may without gainſaying receyue whatſoeuer proceedeth mouth ye ſee modeſtie ought v heereby man may perceiue doltiſhneſſe papiſts ſay ſee humilitie ſo great vertue neuer condemned god hand yea verely manner humilitie humilitie papiſts crouching vnto men ſhaking god yoke yea ſpiting meanes poſſible diueliſh humilitie creature ſhould aduaunced obeyed creator thing nothing let humbling ſelues ſuch ſort maintenance ſayd meekeneſſe towards men may bee mild mind receyue behoofe profite yet neuertheleſſe god may reygne ouer v maſter teacher ſo authoritie lendeth men may derogation himſelfe let v forepoſſeſſed fond imagination ſay ſuch man ſayd therefore muſt beleeued ſuche man mortall man hee frayle creature wherin ther nothing vanitie let v beware ſticking ſo much vnto men wee returne alwayes vnto god grounded vpon certaintie oure fayth bee ioyned knit word thus ye ſee wee haue marke therefore whome wiſdome skifulneſſe wit counſell vvhen ſayd exclude al men sunne ſhineth darkneth light starres men doo god commeth among cauſe ſayd prophet eſay creature muſt ceaſſe god ſhyneth iob ment repeate expreſly heere many word perfection wiſdom god intent wee ſhoulde ſurmiſe needed bee ſupplyed wee ſee men ſo fooliſh haue receyued anie bliſsing god hande muſt adding ſomewhat muſt make ſome mingling muſt patching piecing matter vvhen god putteth wiſdome v muſt bee vſed pure ſimply men muſt adde thing whatſoeuer iob ment ſtep yet farther haue touched afore namely god ſecret wiſdome ſurmounteth capacitie man wherevnto wee cannot attayne yet true god wiſdome diuers ſundrie ſorts reſpecte ſelfe wiſdome thing inſeparable ſuch cannot diuided parted reſpecte v ſeeming god wiſe two ſortes wit wee may ſay two particular kind god wiſdome howbeit reſpect ſelues howe wiſdome conteyned word hee imparteth ſuch wiſe vnto v become wiſe receyuing inſtruction hee giueth v wiſdome whiche hee communicateth creature moreouer wiſdome keepeth ſtill hymſelfe manner one woonderful prouidence whereby gouerneth world beyond wee conceyue beholde god diſpozeth thing take confuzed vnderſtanding vvhen tyrant beare ſway ſhal ſayd hereafter wicked mē ſeduce ſillie folke carie ſoules deſtruction ſort ſaued done wonderfull prouidence god ſeeke reaſon wee ſuch gulfe wit muſt needes ſwallowed vp thus ye ſee wiſdome god keepeth himſelfe whereof maketh men partaker according alſo vnpoſsible atteyne vnto wee ſhall haue bene taught god ſchoole become wiſe comprehending thing according meaſure oure capacitie ſhall haue pleaſed teache v hys worde let v knowe yet ſecrets behoueth v honour foraſmuchas cannot atteyne knowledge bycauſe vnpoſſible v mount ſo high ye ſee wee ought conſider god wiſdome twoo wayes ye ſee alſo iob ment ſpeake thyng whereof make larger diſcourſe heereafter howbeit foraſmuch time beare keepe reſidue till morowe nowe lette v kneele downe face oure good god father acknowledgement oure faultes ſinnes praying voutſafe make v know better feeling ſeebleneſſe v may learne humble ſelues vnder preſume vpon owne ſtrength wiſdome ſeeke want walke vnder hande vnder guidance alſo let v pray gouerne v ſuche wiſe wittes ſenſes may hyld priſoners vnto hee may haue ſuche ſoueraintie ouer v may raigne peaſibly conſent angells obey willingly meane ſeaſon take thing vpon v aboue oure abilitie abuſe giftes hee dealeth vntoo v may alwayes acknowledge come end may ſeeke yeeld hym due prayſe may pleaſe graunt grace c xlvij sermon third vpon twelfth chapter sermon yet ſtil vpon 14 15 16 verſes haue bene touched former sermon ſee thing come paſſe reherced ſeemeth v god gouerneth worlde goeth aduēture rather ther reaſon purpoſe god ſhould ſo could find harte lay v ſet foorth new leſſon point hee ſhould correct though amiſſe ye ſee men wit order ſo raſh could find harte controll god contrariwiſe heere iob meeneth auow mighty power prouidence wiſdome god whereof mention hath bin made therefore telleth v wee ſee thing ſo order world muſt father thing vppon fortune aſſure ourſelues god ſitteth aboue guideth beſides thys although thinke ſtraunge ſhould worke ſo yet let v ſo preſumptuouſe reply againſte hym let v honour ſecrete incomprehenſible wiſdome thus ye ſee two point fathered vpon god heretoſore wit al power al counſel wiſdome skil hath ſet theſe three word purpoſely repreſſe men foliſh preſumptuouſnes taking vpō thē haue diſcretiō reaſon thā god miſliking doings thogh find thē good therfore behoueth v marke well iobs drift whiche make v know god prouidence thing done world neuertheleſſe know god gouerneth haue doo wee muſt alſo graunt wiſdome hath bene ſpoken true oftentimes may perceiue ſome reaſon god work alſo haue men knowe hee doeth ſome one thing alwayes nother muſte wee make generall rule sometimes god blindeth thoſe haue forſaken truthe verie well vengeance euident knowe men haue well deſerued god ſhuld vtterly bereue thē knowledge bycauſe mind taught hand ſometimes knowe wherefore god taketh away word daunteth v cace behoueth v reuerence ſecret determinatiō although knowe yet nother reaſon end worke yet muſt acknowledge confeſſe cannot bee righteous yet meane whyle let v bethinke v weakeneſſe wit intent preſume ſhut vp ne bee deſirouſe meaſure thing infinite owne capacitie let v lay foorth thing particularly ſet downe ſayd god breake downe manſhall buyld vp vvhereby meant god hand againſt v although wee help creature ſhall boote v wee muſt needes periſhe behold effect conteined ſentence firſt bluſh wee may well ſay ſo yet touched ard proofe heereof god ſcourge v wee bethinke v whome wee haue wee go ſeeke meanes ſuccour ſelues ſeemeth v may well ſhifte miſcheefe owne cunning ſo men bee willing helpe v true god forbiddeth v thinke vppon ſelues ſhift ſelues haue regard remedie thing yea hee maketh dealing auayle howbeit ſuche maner wee haue bin inured god afflicteth v firſt remedie humble ourſelues vnder hande ſeeke atonement done may well deſire giue v meanes prouide neceſsities arme ourſelues againſt way warde blowes hande thus yee ſee dutie cleane contrary kind dealing ſee nothing rebelliouſneſſe thys worlde god intendeth humble wee mynded thys doctrine throughly ſhould vſe ſuche maner dealing would come thus oure remembrance god caſt v downe hee build v vp againe therfore muſt hymſelfe faine put hand ſo haue offended let v craue pardon hum end may haue pitie v though iudgements hidden v yet muſt humble ſelues vnto hym ende may receyue v ſo caſt downe deede wee ought gyue good eare threatenings whiche god vttereth purpoſe againſt reprobate ſayeth caſt downe edom aud man labour ſet vp ſhall loſt labour heerein ſee god hand againſt v ſuccour commeth v men creature muſt needes vaine vnauaylable vvee may well haue ſeeming maynteyne v wee ſhall finde profit ſhall go cleane contrarie expectation moreouer ſayde babylon whoſoeuer build vp againe muſt lay foundation vppon firſte borne ſay reſiſt goddes iudgement ſhall followe thoſe haue beene puniſhed afore keepe company themſelues therfore let v bethink v well let v deſire ſtrengthened hand god mainteyned ſtate ſame without muſt needes periſh yea though world ſide haue ſayde already heere yee ſee alſo tolde v pſalme men may well take vppon buylde haue thinges commaundement yet go forward god make go backwarde hee bliſſe doubte word buyld iob comprehendeth concerneth man ſtate ſaid belongeth god build v vp whenſoeuer hath ſet v trade muſt ſtabliſhed ſame power liſteth throwe v quite downe bring v vtterly nought may well euer man v ſhall vtterly vnauaylable contrariwiſe god bee ſide wee may deſpize thing againſt v againe god enimie lette v haue commodity bee ſhall turne confuſion thus much concerning point ſayd immediatly god locke vp man body let iob ſhoulde ſaye belongeth onely god giue v libertie ſo hee liſt although ſeeme haue handes feete libertie ſhall bee forclozed oure limmes wee ſhall bee able ſtirre one finger although men labour drawe v yet ſhall auayle ſo long god holdeth v inclozed ſhet vp fynally betokeneth haue touched already wit god muſt bee fayne fauour v elſe go wrong v ſo ſhall waxe worſe worſe inſomuch tumble right downe firſt blow yet ſhall digged downe little little till god haue vtterly conſumed v hath ſpoken ſo addeth foorthwith god hold backe water ſtop drought god list le • water looce ſhall fluddes beare al afore rake vp earth ſhall bee nother tree houſes left vnouerthrowen iob ſpeaketh purpoſely holding water letting go bycauſe wee knowe god hand ſufficiently worketh one rate wherewith wee acquainted doeth sunne ryſe morning ordinarie thing v thinke nother doeth waken v ſufficiently come vnto god doth hee ſende rayne commeth mind vvhen ſee rayne man aske v ſent confeſſe well ynough god yet conſideration pierceth v quicke therefore moueth v humble ſelues vnder god prouidence acknowledge hand directeth life thinke iob hath made choice ſuch work rareſt leaſt accuſtomed •• g men ſee drought laſteth euery man touched make faire wether rayne meane ſo earth doeth vtterly drye vp men thinke come ſo great drought men perceiue corne cannot growe thriueth behold ſeede dryed vp ground commeth nothing frute come come ſuch extraordinarie drought ye ſhall ſee v touched euēſo alſo great rage water ſend shower anoy tuſh ouerpaſſe haue regard god continuall rayne ſo riuers ouerflowe bank ſeemeth new generall flud marke beare mind iobs meening thing happen ſuch wiſe may ſeeme order nature ſhal change ſo exceſsiue drought may ſeeme ſhall burnt vp wee muſt know god hath layd bridle looce fortune necke himſelfe worketh faſhion alſo whē falleth ſo great rayne likely ſhall go hauocke let v aſſure ſelues god whyche worketh certeſſe drought may well come ſometimes notorious ſinnes ſo men may perceiue wherfore god vengeance lighteth according hee threateneth v law ſhet vp heauen ſuch wiſe ſhall braſſe drop moyſture gotten thence earth ſhall become hard yron ſo ſeedes ſhall dwin ground ſhall yeelde nurriſhment hart alſo ayre ſhall deafe earth openeth cranyed mouth thirſt ayre ſhall anſwer lord doeth rightly manace v lawe execute ſuch puniſhmentes vppon v verily oure ſinnes ſake neuerthelater ſometimes fall wee cannot diſcerne god worketh ſo wee ſhall haue ſuch knowldge may leade v iudge god ſheweth v reaſon therof neuertheleſſe becommeth v honour power wiſdome althogh end thereof vnknowen v muſt humble ſelues ſorts whether wee ſee earth drowned water whether bee ſeared vp drought let god bee alwayes glorified maner euen confeſsing doth firſt behoueth v acknowledge power afterward muſt match power ſuch wiſdome grudge agaynſt blame tyrannie outrage one ſay true god gouerneth worlde therwithal imagin tirannicall power haue touched alreadie glorifie god aright muſt acknowledge almightie therwithall muſt alſo honor infinite wiſdome whervnto cannot attayne conſideration wherof ſame ought made ſubiect vnderſtanding neither ought god yeeld v account doings iob repeateth againe power skill rightneſſe ſecond word ſet commeth hebrue beeing ſo ſignifieth beeing therefore man may take thing haue ſeeming yet firme ſubſtantiall like creature may well make ſome ſhewe ſeeme flouriſh howbeeit ſame ſhadow periſheth hand thēſelues vaniſhe away vnleſſe god maintaine god euerlaſting firmneſſe euer hath beene euer ſhall bee alſo giueth power creature ſo continue ſtate ſayde worde therfore well deriued beeing neuertheleſſe oftentymes taken god lawe inſtruction alſo taken prince commiſsiō proclamation wee haue ſeene heretofore iob ſpeaketh onely god mightie power ſhoulde ſay hath thing hand alſo ſayd perfectly wiſe prouidence wōderfull thē let v mark well ſtreyne meeneth ſpeake god beeing rather vprightneſſe gouernment vſeth wee knowe aſmuch iudge worlde muſt needes gouerne thing vprightly ſo nothing repetition matter bene delt howbeeit without cauſe doeth iob repeate although god workes eies yet hard come conſideration wee com wee forget remembrance thereof refreſhed v let v marke well ſentence meeneth wit god power alſo gouernment worlde belongeth order thing indifferencie vprightneſſe vvhē wee ſhall haue recorded leſſon throughly wee ſhall haue profited greatly onely day time life alſo one ſpeciall cauſe whiche iob repeateth leſſon intent enter god iudgements ſtraunger v thoſe hath ſpoken ſpecially hee ſayeth hee deceyueth bee deceyued god hande yee ſee heere thing ſeemeth agaynſt reaſon namely god hath deceyuers hand driueth thervnto ſemeth point vtterly repugnant nature iob thē hath purpoſely vſed preface brydle v ſhould r • ſh headlong agaynſt god although wee bee troubled wyth ſome temptation firſt brunt yet notwithſtanding might reſtreyned become like many wilde beaſts lift vp themſelues agaynſt god rayling blaſpheming hee ſpoyle himſelfe owne mightie power inſomuch wee ſee howe aſhamed f •• ſh villanous curſed ſpeeche beleeue god rightuous bee doer thing ſpecially ſo farre foorth driue forwarde euill meanes ſay ſhoulde author ſin hath ſhewed vnto euen much would frame god theyr owne fancie bycauſe comprehende hys wonderfull wiſedome honour ſame though bee hidden v yee ſee howe arrogant beaſts cannot agree god ſhould almightie except might make ſubiect owne faſhion fancie common prouerbe ſayeth none ſo bold blind bayard ſay behold conceyue art thou▪ haue ſeene ſillie fooles although play doctor ſome one ſcience yet notwithſtanding bee ſo ouerignorant pitie ſee man may perceiue nothing beaſtlyneſſe thē yet neuertheleſſe ſo bolde ſay vnderſtand therfore cānot agree thereto although wiſeſt wilyeſt man worlde yet ought men ſpitte face abhorre hee dare ſet vp briſtles maner agaynſt god ſee iob hath giuen v good profitable leſſon namely whereas ment ſay god hath deceyuers deceyued hand put preface afore power skil let v come make compariſon betwene wit god mightie power able incloſe brayne mā ſhould go incloſe heauen earth narrowe roome yet man aduaunce himſelfe thither pray monſtrouſneſſe man knoweth whether creator ne paſſeth apperteyneth vntoo let v remember wel ſaid namely although think hard god ſhoulde haue hande deceyue deceyued yet ſo neuertheleſſe vvhy god almightie thing might bee done worlde againſt without medling almightie yes truly ſome man ſay reaſon thou muſt ſeeke reaſon otherwhere bycauſe thou canſt attayne vnto thou muſt lowlineſſe honour ſurmounteth thy capacitie thou canſt ſtye aboue cloudes god muſt acknowledged bee wiſe almightie thou perceyue reaſon well tarie thou leyſure ſilence quietneſſe vntill hee diſcouer thing vntoo thee yet vnknowne ment ſaying ſhall behold thing face face cannot ſee glaſſe dimly would make ſcripture falſe▪ theſe vai • glorious beaſts deface darken prouidence god vnder colour conceyue reaſon cannot brooke cōteyned holy scripture would haue god reſerue nothing laſt day finde fault making greater clerkes ſeing men perceiue ſo ignorant dulheaded although make greate ſhewe haue neyther iudgement diſcretion deed although men haue eſtimation whether way ſcorn otherwiſe yet ſeene dull beaſtes vvhy blame god giuing fyner wit giuing meane profite better ſchoole ſeeme themſelues bee worthieſt men world▪ yet hath god giuē ouer vvhy blame handling thē owne luſt owne opinion bee ſo wiſe men worlde ought make ryde triūphing chariot yet meane ſeene haue ſtore reply find fault god take hande bring account part let v kepe ſayd namely wee muſt bee ſo ſimple honor god prouidence wiſdome notwithſtāding ſame hidden v furthermore let v come whiche iob ſayeth heere concerning deceyued deceyueth vvhereas ſayth twaine well deceyuer deceiued god hand meeneth reſpect creature haue life colde ſaying ſhoulde import nothing vvee knowe treateth god iudgementes whiche incomprehenſible whervnto wit able reach nowe ſo ſtraunge verdite ſay god hath made men beholdeth well wicked deceytfull alſo deceyued whit al without common order nature wee ſee iob ment wade wit man erreth deceiued ſame cōmeth paſſe without god wil ordinance alſo whē deceiuer bringeth craft ſuttleties god gouerneth aboue thoſe woulde accuſe god vnrightuouſneſſe vnder colour ſuffereth thing done men doth himſelfe beſeech reſolue queſtion iob hath ſayde power vprightneſſe god hee addeth deceyued deceyuers hand▪ lo iob auoweth god mightie power hee hath gouernment world ſaying deceyuers deceiued hand ſingle ſufferance iob ſpoken ill muſt concluded god guideth thing ſuche wiſe nothing done otherwiſe hath ordeined way muſt beare minde haue touched alreadie namely god wil ſometimes haue men deceiued reaſō wil haue ſo apparant ſometimes alſo know al wherof cōmeth whereto tendeth cace behoueth v hold wit brydle acknowledging ſelues ignorant feeblewitted atteyne ſo high god wil deceit ſhould reigne men ſhould beguiled holy ſcripture ſheweth tolde v god doeth giue leaue ſhuld ſay paſſe medle cōmaundeth inſomuch ſayth ſhall go deceyue beholde god ſeeketh deceiuers haue deceites haue full ſcope ſo ſpeakes holy scripture vvhat gloſe cā alledged darkē ſo euidēt text diuell offereth himſelf ſaying go lying ſpirit mouth al prophet begu • le achab thervpō god ſendeth satan forth▪ willeth deceyue blind king people ſee wel god ſhrinketh corner ſay wil ſuffer done ordeineth diſpoſeth otherwiſe ſayd almighty vvhē ſcripture giueth title vnto god meeneth liſt reſt heauen doth nothing meaneth god mighty power matched effect wit preſent thing thing done otherwiſe hee diſpoſeth yee ſee manner god almightie thē babble ſo diſfeate reſtreme god prouidence denie firſt article fayth lyke witleſſe folke poſſeſſed diueliſhrage therefore vnleſſe make ſcripture falſe ſettled point muſt hold v god haue men deceyued▪ ſayd ſo text alſo throughout whole holy scripture aboue others notable place paule ought bee ſo much familiar v bycauſe haue experience proofe paule treating ſtate chriſtian church come ſayeth ſhall falling away ſo mē ſhal become renegats goſpel hath bin preached vnto ſhall renoūce god ſhall horrible ſcattering whole church thing ſee yet notwithſtanding papiſts forbeare ſay hath god ſuffered churche erre ſo long time behold paule telles v ſhould ſo ſame come god ſingle ſufferāce paule ſayeth expreſly god ſend effectuall errour ſayeth onely god let satā looce deceiue men ſaith deceit leazings muſt take effect mē ſhall able kepe thēſelues beguiled ſee god horrible vengeance eye men haue bin blynded ſo haue perceyued lye deceit satan haue bin caryed away thē like brute beaſts vvhoſe god paule auoucheth expreſly beit true behalfe manifeſt reaſon paule ſayth ſayd ſcattering ſhall happen men vnthākfulneſſe bycauſe haue refuſed honor god therfore muſt faine beare yoke men ſubiect tiranny mind obey truth therfore god fed lye according alſo ſhewed firſte chapter roman ſomuch world coueteth deceiued yea ſhetteth eye whē god goeth inlighten word need muſt satā beguile miſleade ſomtimes ſame ſhall come paſſe know man demaund reaſon hath made long diſcourſe ſhall wit end thē let v marke wel although perceyue reaſon god doth thing yet muſt ſtoupe downe necke ſay reuerence mightie powe raſſuring ſelues ſame ruled al vprightnes indifferencie notwithſtanding priuy yea euē ſuche time god blindeth men raiſeth vp deceiuers beguile ſo falſe doctrine abuſes hereſies haue full ſcope god giueth satāful power puniſh ſinnes furthermore man might moue yet many queſtiōs poſsible god ſhoulde ſerue owne turne satā nothing malice naughtineſſe beſides looke vpon wicked mā hath none intent ouerthrowe goodneſſe deſtroy yet doth bringeth paſſe seemeth hee acquit bycauſe ſeruice hath bene accompliſhing god men moue ſuch queſtions theſe ſerue grauell oure wit cauſe iob ſayde hath vſed preface power dominion god ſay forſomuch hath al thing hande reaſon ſhould diſpoſe creature owne pleaſure forſomuchas iudge whole worlde therefore cannot amiſſe nother impoſsible ſwarue one waye right dealing although vnknowne v fountayne rightuouſneſſe vvhen man hath doone thing examined vvhy ſo wee haue rule aboue v verely wittes changeable good euill yea worſe naturally altogither euill crooked vntoward rightneſſe thē ſubiect caried heere owne fancie reaſon whereof dooings neede examined ſhould bee hygher rule ouer thē mē ſhould haue rule thēſelues certaine would nothing cōfuſion ſtate yee ſee heathē mē thēſelues ſayd lawe ought god ouer v god ought bee lawe cace ſtandeth ſo god therefore come rule right rightuouſneſſe wherby muſte ruled wherto muſte ſubiect aboue v god aboue according haue ſhewed alredie god rightuouſneſſe two ſorts one hath ſhewed v lawe haue world ruled incomprehenſible inſomuch thē muſt faine winck whē god worketh content knowe nother doth ſo whē reaſon god doings reueled vnto v let v vnderſtand ſame poynt rightuouſneſſe ſecrete wyll whiche ſurmounteth • ule manifeſt knowne v verely doctrine wil hard many mē let v content ſelues auouched v seing scripture ſpeaketh ſo v muſte anſwer amen acknowledge thing told v wit ſee folke erre deceyuers haue full ſcope ſame happeneth without god prouidence beſides hath bene ſayd let v alſo bethink v warning paule alſo prophet eſay giue men looke well vpon themſelues ſhall ſo hardie lifte vp ſelues againſt god checke agaynſt truthe vvee bee earth dung authoritie hath god men looked well vpō owne ſtate ſurely would preſume lift vp thē ſelues ſuche wiſe againſt god alſo theſe dogges forbeare barke though cannot byte would ſo bold let v leaue point ſtil cōtent thēſelues holy ſcripture ſpeaketh let go ſeeke anſwers otherwheres take greate paynes anſwere queſtiōs purpoſe tempt god manifeſtly deſire paſſe boundes behold god telleth v doth many thing whereof reaſon concealed frō v deſirous know ſame forcible breaking wall god hath ſet
