agaynſt v hath barred v frō ſhould ſay ye ſhall paſſe beyond wee paſſe plaine deſpiſing god let v ouer labour ſelues content fond curioſitie thoſe auaunce themſelues maner againſt god rather let v lerne con • ute faſhion maner paules ſpeeche ſaying art thou ô man one word man man ynough ſtop mouthes ſuch lift vp themſelues wiſe agaynſt god vnder word man comprehēded ſo much wretchedneſſe ought caſt downe head alſo earth could open ſhould ſwallowed bottomleſſe pit haue diueliſhe pride v lifting vp ſelues againſt god moreouer lette v marke doctrine bringeth v great comfort ſo applie ſame vſe vvhen ſaid deceiuers deceyued belong vnto god thereby vnderſtande god bridleth satan deceyuers ſo cannot without bee troubled falſe doctrine hereſies darnell ſerueth turne v aſide frō pureneſſe goſpel god holdeth deceyuers hand yea euen satan head vnto thē ſerue turne seeing god holdeth ſo hande certaine attempt nothing farther giueth bridle although attempt yet haue aduauntage ouer v bycauſe thoſe deceyued likewiſe hande god ſeing hand let v referre ſelues vnto ſuffer v number thoſe satan ouerthroweth ſhall alwayes get vpper hand lie ſhal trump wayes lo ought practize doctrine murmuring againſt god deſiring make fond ſhe fooliſh brauerie ſay tuſh diſpute agaynſt man cannot yeeld reaſon neuer bowe let v beware making ſuch brag haue ſayde let v rather humble ſelues honor thing reuerence know although ſee thing ſo confuzed world remayneth nothing v fal deſtruction let v afrayd foraſmuch god gouerneth thing hath ſoueraine dominion ouer creature let v warrant ſelues god well ynough diſappoint policie deadly enemie satan craft deceit men ſo ſhal haue vpper hand otherſide although god liſt afflict v ſuffer hereſies run abrode ſo many trouble inſue wee ſee thing cōfounded world yet full well preſerue v ſhall miſcarie muſt giue satan error effect ſenced wel inough lord ieſus chriſt faith impoſsible euer choſen ſhoulde turned way ſaluation seing thē cace ſtādeth ſo let v put ſelues god protection forſomuch pleaſeth cō mit charge welfare lord ieſus chriſt let v cōtent ſelues therwith let v reſt let v toſſed vnquietneſſe ſay ſhal ſcape daūger vndoing true ought ſtand vpon gard carefull call vpō god whē haue called vpō walking purenes life let v dout maintemeth v ſuch wiſe al trouble worlde doo v harm ſhould always abide ſtedfaſt truth ſame truth inuincible fortreſſe v according alſo paul ſpeaketh let v caſt ſelues downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v perceyue maner one rudeneſſe brutiſhneſſe end may lerne humble ſelues vnder glorifie caces walke ſuch ſort feare may thinke good rightfull whatſoeuer diſpoſeth v creature ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father c xlviij sermon fourth vpon xij chapter 17 putteth counſellers ſpoile maketh iudges dull vvitted 18 loozeneth band king girdeth reines vvith girdle 19 putteth prince ſpoile diſtreſſeth mightie 20 taketh avvay ſpeech faithfull taketh avvay courage prince 21 poureth contempt vpon noble hetaketh avvay ſtrength mightie 22 bringeth hidden thing light ſhadovv death vnto open light 23 increaſeth people deſtroyeth enlargeth nation ſtreitneth 24 taketh avvay heartes gouernours earth maketh vvander vvilderneſſe 25 maketh grope darke vvithout light maketh reele like drunken men like yeſterday ſaw god hath hand deceyuers deceiued ſo iob proceedeth declare change turning ſene world com paſſe haphazard god diſpoſition ſtādeth v hand knowe worlde ſo turmoyled ſecrete brydle aboue ſo thing neuer ſo confounded god diſpoſeth thinketh good hee taketh notableſt thing wee might thereby perceyue god prouidence better ſhoulde ſeeme prince priuiledged aboue reſt worlde ye would ſay ſholed common ranke men iob ſheweth god doth cheefly vtter power haue bee cheefly knowne ſome poore man afflicted light aduerſitie vpon regarde commonly inured ſuch matter prince ſeemed hoyſſed vp aloft caſt downe bee touched wee muſt needes eſpye god prouidence blockiſh alſo haue gouernment people become ſo dull witted neyther vnderſtanding reaſon alſo well worthie marked loke neerlier priuate perſons ſpecially men haue good wit haue ſome learning experience haue bene wholy faſhioned deale publike gouernment afterward ſodenly become dullard men afore ſuch maner chaunge ſo notable conſtreyneth v looke vp vnto god cauſe iob ſpeaketh cōmon people gouerners ſpeketh ſimple ydiots thoſe men haue knowne greate wiſdome inſomuch ſeemed haue bene able ynough haue gouerned whole worlde yet notwithſtanding deſtitute wit reaſon lo effect ſhewed v heere howbeit foraſmuch talke cōcerneth notable thing ſuch import much matter iob thinketh inough vtter minde word twaine repeteth ſaying god putteth prince ſtrong men men might ſpoyle vntieth band ſo ther ſubiectiō alliance nothing worth whē haue ſword ſide ſhall fall groūd ſhort meanes whiche prince earth haue ſhall ſerue thē purpoſe whē god liſteth pul thē downe iob therfore ſtādeth vpon poynt bicauſe one ſide ſuch lazineſſe v otherſide ſeeth ſo blind thing ought conſider moſt although partly know god doings ſuch chaunges happen yet cannot ſame ſink mind ſuch maner iob ſpeakes although haue well bethought v yet make profit neuertheleſſe behoueth v know god ſo gouerne cheef ſtates world arme alſo ſtretched leſſer thing ſo nothing eſcapeth lo haue marke effect haue ſayd whē cheef ſtates changed euery mā moued anon think indeed ſee ſtories full conteined yet world fareth ſo much better therby ſo perſuaded ought god prouidence hee hath ſoueraine dominion ouer thing thing neuer yet throughly well knowne hath bin let owne blockiſhneſſe let v mark wel god delighteth chaunge men imagine wheele fortune heatheniſhe folke ſay god playeth men mā toſſeth balles teniſplay ſo theſe chaunges happen bycauſe cannot ſuffer god cōtinue grace towards vvhen thing ſetled good plight behold men wearie eaſe friske kicke lyke horſes well fed authoritie forget themſelues deſpiſe god imagine ther brydle vpō thē lo lord ſendeth chaunges world bicauſe cannot abide ſhould hold one euen cōtinuall rate ouer v behoofe make v knowe one ſhould perceyue ſoueraine creature although prince ſuch honour abuſed ſtate auauncing themſelues al vngraciouſneſſe yet puffed vp pride thinke themſelues worthie come high degree haue purchaſed ſame owne policie ſo god nobodie otherſide would opiniō nothing el reigneth fortune god therefore muſt bee faine diſcouer thing good buried ende wee may knowe hath ordering thing cauſe ſo great alteration happen worlde vvhen man readeth chronicle would wonder ſhould poſsible whereas bin ſo great monarchie thing haue bin ouerthrowne ſo ſmal time ſo ſtraunge faſhion men would neuer haue thought let v loke vpō firſt monarchy aſſyrians chaldies let v take ſo great ſtate might well haue ſeemed euerlaſting ſhould neuer haue bin ouerthrowne ſhall find ſame thing ſpake loke vpō perſians medes reigned ouer aſia inſomuch man hundred league countrie nothing armyes fiuehundred thouſand men readines theſe thing ſufficiently warrāted ſo fable thing inuented ſayde certentie thē euident ynough yet al one prince thirtie thouſande men diſcomfited one hoſte three hundred thouſand another ſeuenhundred thouſand man would wonder reading ſuch thing yea god blinded thoſe erſt thought themſelues bee ſo come toppe ſtrength owne ſeeming man durſt open lip bin able haue ouerwhelmed enemy blaſt mouth god ment mocke ſuch pride meanes great monarchie ouerthrowne god ſhould break man girdle aſunder ſword ſhould fall away euen ſo ſay befall perſians medes vvell hath great alexander gotten ſuch victory ſides like thunderclap ouercommeth man doth heare noiſe ſeene god tooke worlde floure age remayned hee heires male wife mother brother ſhort ſo great kinred might ſeeme hys race ſhould neuer haue fayled gotten ſuch empire leaſtwiſe child worthie haue ſucceeded taken mortall man honored god men warre yelded ſuch reuerence would haue ſticked haue died in linage yet al one taile whole ofſpring left al fayne go ſlaughter blud bee ſhed like filled earth bloud crueltie god rooted houſe vvhen ſee ſee wonderfull iudgements neuer read holy scripture may eſpie ſo diuine power muſt ſpite teeth cōfeſſe god reigning heauen executeth ſuch iuſtice neuer looked haue alledged one example ſayd ſtories full theſe thing yet little men fare better man come empire rome ſtate ſettled ſuch wiſe likelyhood euer ſhould remoued bare authoritie common wealth rome neuer ſuffered bodie impeache ſtate yet neuertheleſſe ſame faine come paſſe came paſſe empire fell vnto obteyned verely euen ſorce warre libertie oppreſſed neither heire ſucceſſor could ſayde prince emperour inſomuch hoped thing ſhould haue bin ſet againe former ſtate notwithſtanding thing ſo turmoyled child became emperor auguſtus caeſar began reigne neither wiſedome wit thing elſe ſo empire caſt lap aſleepe deed ſhould haue fought field bed much doo rize therefore ſeemed emperourſhip fell dreame yet done haphazard god abate pryde citie rome ſo afterwarde neatcherd became emperor ſonne brothell could brag nothing owne brother ſonne mother vnkindly inceſt came aunceters man tell whence came whether bredde ou • earth water ye ſee ſo ſhamefull thing would make mannes heare ſtande vp vpon head heare ſtoryes read god ordeyned ſuch wiſe ende might better knowne ſuch chaunges happen men inſtruction ſayde fullye hundreth ſeuenth pſalme let v marke well without cauſe iob ſtandeth ſo much vpon poynt hee ſayeth god blindeth prince ſo neyther wiſdome diſcretion aught elſe ſeemeth bereft wit yea thing ſhal light vpō minute houre afterwarde cut aſunder girdle theyr ſword ſhall fal ſuch wiſe ſhall force beſides men haue thē eſtimation god maketh thē deſpiſed inſomuch ſayde poureth reproch vppon heere three things▪ wherof two viſible mainteyning prince third ſecret two viſible thing force wiſdom ye ſee king reigneth whēce hath authoritie wiſe haue skilfull counſellers ſo thing well guided aduiſe hys affayres lay aforehand beholde one meane king hath men greate furniture warre well alyed hath ſtrong hold countrie thus ye ſee two thing perceiue ſtandards kingdomes principality ſtates world wit force wiſdome god ouerthroweth force ſo becommeth nothing worth take away wiſdome thoſe great forecaſt ye ſhal ſee ſo daunted haue leſſe wit little child third thing ſecret world god imprinteth certain maieſtie prince ſo honored knowne according ſayde daniel god minded ſtabliſh great empire chaldie put feare terror al creature looke vpon balſaſar looke vpon nabuchadneſar king god magnified ſuch wiſe bird ayre ſtoode feare awe wherof came ſuch conceyt euen god printed image conſidering pride men let v think kingdomes could ſtand ſtedfaſt except god mainteyned meanes aforeſayd euery man would lord mā would beare yoke ſuch ſtatelineſſe nature men euery man eſteemes himſelfe worthie king commeth paſſe thē men ſuffer ſmal number ſome one alone reigne ouer bycauſe god wil order ſhould among mē ſayde god poure contempt reproch vpon thoſe haue bin noble men haue reuerenced ſo god make laughing ſtocke inſomuch men ſhall flout make none account vvhy ſo bicauſe belongeth ſet vp pull downe therfore let v marke well three thing ſpoken prince world truſt munition fortreſſes people reuenewes mainteyne ſayd god cut bandes aſunder abate force vnbuckle girdle vaine prince think ſhall continue euer bicauſe bee well ſtored fenced furniſhed thing harte deſire ſoone god ſhall blowe vpon nothing ſhall auaile thē prince truſt wiſedome ſhall happen likewiſe ſee alſo prophet mocke vaine ouerweening vnbeleeuers enemy god vvhere ſage counſellers pharao hath egypt renoume vntill ſuch ſort greate policie worlde behold dulled bereft diſcretion howe vaniſhed away wiſe would haue thought god hath done ſayeth prophet eſay let thoſe great one worlde learne humble thēſelues let bee caried away fonde ouer weening though able mainteyne thēſelues wiſdome ſtrength wee ſee geere ſmoke god great men world cā yeelde themſelues therevnto herken doctrine leaſtwiſe let example ſerue inſtruction let v thinke vpon knowne vnto v god hath ſhewed v ſmall fauour hee ſetteth king prince vpō ſcaffold teach v end euery v ſhould humble himſelfe walke aduiſedly knowing god gouerneth thing diſpoſeth creature owne pleaſure ſhall prince blinded perſones god giueth v profitable inſtructiō fault ſelues little one therfore muſt vnderſtād ſingular fauour god ſheweth teacheth thē ſo ſchoole meane leaueth thoſe far highlieſt aduaunced world herewithal alſo let v marke well god ſo chaunge ſtates prince abate force thoſe ſeeme ſo puiſſant ſtrong al thing quake vnder thē ſhal become ſuch nothing cōpariſon let v go boaſt owne greatneſſe ſtrength looke vpon theſe great king monarkes haue lorded ouer al men god hath cōfoūded twinkling eye pray ſhall become theſe glorious fellowes haue nothing compariſon vnder colour wote thinke themſelues maruelous men beare thēſelues hand ought flie aboue clowds bicauſe haue one peece finger vpon men yet idol thēſelues god needeth cace vtter great iudgemēt worthie remēbrance fooliſhnes laughingſtocke euen little child thinke god leaueth ſuch ouerweening pryde vnpuniſhed ſeeing ſtinketh ſo ſight world cannot bee abidden moreouer hath ground colour v priuate perſones let v well ware ſet vp briſtles god peculiar office daunt proude reſiſt labour ſtriue aduaunce themſelues ſo much rougher muſt god hande cōfound therefore let v bee afrayde lift vp ſelues agaynſt god hande ouerheauie wee come againſt furthermore haue touched alreadie wee muſte vnderſtand men muſt glorie owne skil wiſdome ſee ſayd iudges coūſellers king god mainteyne common weales holy thing world beſtoweth ſpirit vpon thoſe worthie king coūſellers ſuch haue charge gouerne people may haue ſome wiſedome howbeeit themſelues ſo much god ſetteth ſtate requiſite haue ſome peculiar thing whiche owne nature god doth although men bee worthie reaſon whereof intendeth maynteyne order hath ſet neuertheleſſe fayleth afterwarde bereeue king prince coūſellers wit reaſon deale thus towards thoſe beſtoweth ſpirite extraordinarily ſhall betyde priuate perſones lette v learne walke modeſtly thinke ſelues ſo well appoynted thing owne witte reaſon god able bereeue v true god leaue men witte reaſon yet meane ſhall take none effect wee ſee example achitophell god ſuffereth bee alwayes man great aduice deed great policie counſell gaue abſalom vvell yee ſee achitophell politike wit owne god abated whit yet brought enterpriſe paſſe god blinded well abſalom alſo counſell ſo achitophell beleeued vvee ſee god abridgeth effect force craftie wylie ſight worlde ſometimes alſo maketh dull doltiſh iob ſpeaketh euen ſo likewiſe befalleth priuate perſons man looke vpon howe yee ſhall ſee man ſo good skill lay aforehand owne matter fault found yet proſpereth god hath cut effect ſuch man wiſedome made purpoſe therefore befalleth perceyue prouidence god howbeit may alſo come paſſe man whiche polityke great forecaſt ſhall ſo fond act ſhall irke men ſee poſsible ſhall men ſay ſo forecaſting man hath giuen counſell men ſhould fall ſuch ſo groſſe follie cauſe god hath wrought done god giue v wit wiſdome▪ firſt let v vſe wee ought ſay let v apply wit vnto euill beguile men deale deceytfully doo harme hinderance let ſerue mainteyne goodneſſe repreſſe euill therewithall let v ſtill pray god ſtabliſh wit hee hath gyuen v aſſuring ſelues continuall heritage god neede continue grace hath begoone wee may bee vtterly bereft day ere morrowe therefore wee muſt thinke thus ſelues god thou haſte aſsiſted ſo much indetted thee yet take thy ſpirite mee man owne wit haue ſerued turne well day yeare whole tyme life let yeelde honour vnto god ſaying lord beholding thee haue ſtoode ſelfe therefore thou muſt bee fayne vpholde ſtill nothing ſelfe yee ſee wee haue doo whereas ſayde god taketh away witte thoſe whiche well aduiſed making grope darke ſuch wiſe bee blinde drunken power fore vaniſhed away become nothing ſo god liſted muſt needes come vtter decay vvhen heare let v take example haue ſayde muſt leaue firſt article namely god poureth reproche alſo vpon ſuch noble whiche reuerence honour vppon god ſpreade contempt ſhall ſo full ſhame men ſhall ſcoffe ſhall haue reputation hereby bee taught although wee haue poſsible wiſhed nothing ſhall ſerue v contempt commeth ſhall nother ſhape fauour aught el men ſee v ſuch contempt bee demaunded whereof commeth man tell ſay yee ſhall ſee men aduaunced great eſtate dignitie yea euen mightieſt king world yet ſhall runne contempt want good iudgement aduiſedneſſe want meanes force policie men know therefore bee ſo imbaſed runne contempt may men perceyue hand god vpon them▪ let men ſearch ſhall find prince haue ſometimes beene ſo ſhamefull looce liuers worthie haue bene bottom alehouſe borthelhouſe yet al mainteyned authoritie otherſome hauing erſt bene men age great wiſedome authoritie god made deſpyſed ſo ſhifte themſelues fall downe herein let v beholde god iudgements learne ſuch thing happen vnto thoſe aduaunced aboue common aray men god may well abace v wil fill v full ſhame although bene great dignitie reputation furthermore iob hauing ſpoken ſo prince chaunges happen ſtates addeth muſt alſo behold god iudgements bodie people hee hath ſpoken head cōmeth body behold people ſayeth growne great mightie ſee howe god bringeth nothing another people inlargeth ſpreadeth boundes far god hemmeth certeſſe men cōmonly father thing vpon fortune bycauſe men blinde themſelues owne vnthankefulneſſe wee would open eye certaine god iudgements ſo manifeſt cace men could gainſay thē alſo cauſe ſayd ende 107 pſalme god prouidence treated mouth vnrightuouſneſſe ſhall ſtopped wicked may well deface god maieſtie vttermoſt power yet muſt needes conuinced haue wel conſidered doings thing whole worlde muſt needes haue theyr mouthes ſtopped lyke ſayd god ſmiteth vpon thigh proude head ſmal one muſt need take occaſion tremble humble themſelues god viſiteth whole bodye togyther ſay people ſhal become euery ſeueral mē ber euery ſeuerall perſone god ſpareth whole countrie ſhal become thus ye ſee howe ought applie great thing vnto ſmall ende euery man ſeuerally may learne walk hūbly vnder mightie hande god frame ſelfe thereafter acknowledge god bee whole ſoueraine hee handle v another faſhion ſpoken wit ſo ſhall perceyue protection wonderfull towards v men offer themſelues god ſuffer gouerne wil ſtretch hand mainteyne ſtate alwayes vphold power wil ſhielde defence agaynſt euill aduentures men needes flye highe god muſt needes ſtoppe muſt euery v needes crouch ſee god ſmyteth whole nation ſort firſt ſtandeth v hand throughly perſuaded conteyned ſhall elſe take inſtruction haue layde forth let v aſſure ſelues lord ſhal haue multiplyed people well diminiſh leſſe nothing happen great alteration realme let v aſſure ſelues ſame cō meth paſſe hap hazard god worker therefore wee muſt bee throughly reſolued thoſe two thing true may wel talke thē ſhall neuer good earneſt till wee haue well ſtudied leſſon euery v bee well practized ſuch wyſe ſame may neuer bee blotted remēbrance let v aſſure ſelues howe ſoeuer world goeth god ruleth thing ſuch wiſe ought bee ſo witleſſe father thing vpon fortune ſay poynt whereat ought begin namely hauing full aſſuredneſſe god prouidence apply ſame owne vſe ſayde muſt make owne profite bycauſe ſee ſome fantaſticall head talke god prouidence none ende intangle thēſelues ſuch ſpeculatiōs ſo groſſe pity ſee thē bring edification wel ynough ſay god chaungeth god remoueth edified feare verye truth holy scripture ſpeaketh v god prouidence intent therby ſhould know mightie power wyſe knowe end honour holdeth v hys hand hath ful ſoueraintie ouer life death ſay bee ſubiect vnto ſeeing hath authoritie ouer v ſide scripture ſheweth v god wiſe gouerning worlde according haue ſaid already thē v ſay god doth liſteth wote whither good bad contrarywiſe muſt cōfeſſe euer doth wel done although knowe reaſon yet muſt wee honour ſecrete wiſdome concluſion wee muſt tarie leyſure tyll hee ſhewe v wherefore chaūgeth ſhifteth ſtates world ſort therwithall muſt haue eye open thing manifeſt behold god bleſſeth people wherefore euen owne mere goodneſſe ſake wee muſt ſeeke deſertes men god ſheweth thē fauour thē ſee god ſpred goodneſſe vpon people hee magnified ſame people outrageouſly gyuen euill god viſit muſt wee alſo thinke cauſe behalfe lyke theſe dayes ſee ſo great confuſions worlde would greeue man hart wee ſee alſo wickedneſſe become like flowing floud yee ſee countrie farre ſquare great outragious vyces god ſcourges follow ſay within muſte wee needes cace acknowledge god bee rightuous iudge wee may iuſtly condemne periſhe haue condemned muſt wee ſtreytwayes come ſelues principall poynt v profite oure ſelues men coſt god doth v pleaſure warne v aforehande ende euery v ſhoulde come home againe yee ſee ſorte wee may fare better god prouidence according ſhewed v ſtreyn ſayd immediatly god bringeth darkneſſe light yea euen darkneſſe hat darke death ſay darkeneſſe hell ſame bring light hee lyſteth iob expreſſerh meening namely rehearce vntoo v thoſe workes god moſt famous ſhoulde ſpeake cōmon ordinarie workes would ſlepe would touche v whit haue declared alreadie therefore muſt warned ſuch ſort wittes may aſtoniſhed yea wee may quickned vp lazie dullminded ſo euer bee thus ye ſee iob ment ſaying god bring darkeneſſe death vnto lighte might well haue ſayd god maketh ſunne ſhine euery day ſee night hath courſe day ſucceedeth lo heere great wonderfull chaunge iob might haue ſpoken ſo foraſmuche ordinarie thing among v paſſe therefore intended touch extraordinarie thing ſayd god maketh ſuch alteration hell aduaunced vp aloft death ſet vp high men behold darkneſſe chaungeth ſo light ſtraunge faſhion ſuch one neuer looked thereby god wakeneth v vp giueth v cauſe thinke better vpon power haue erſt done let v remember leſſon well wee neuer better inſtructions god giueth v day day yea although worke ſuch miracle ought moue v throughly think vpon yet wee whit touched vvherefore muſt bee fayne worke another faſhion crie aloude vve bee like man layde bed falne faſt aſleepe thouſande thing may ſpoken hee heareth folke may talke diſcourſe many matter aſleepe ſhall knowe neuer whit one make great noyſe ye ſhall ſee wake man cannot ſpeake ſo ſoftly heare ſayd ſtandeth cace v god ſheweth v many thing ought ſerue inſtruction haue eyesſhet hee ſpeaketh v heare nothing bicauſe bee aſleepe therefore muſt faine make great noiſe waken v end may think ſo much better vpon prouidence acknowledge god wakeneth v therefore v ſluggiſhe ſo ſhoulde haue regarde profit ſelues iudgementes hee ſheweth v vvherfore let v aduiſedly ſhroud v vnder protectiō doubting inaſmuch hath creature hand yea euen vnto little ſparrowes ſmall value eſtimation neuer forget v ſomuch creature ſaſhioned owne image alſo bicauſe child according hath adopted v lord ieſus chriſt let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgem • fault praying make v feele better may abhorre condemne flouthfulneſſe v ſenſes inlighten v holy ſpirite bicauſe blinde euen lighſommeſt manifeſteſt thing therfore let v pray open eye ſuch ſort may behold great ſecretes heauēly kingdome yea may beholde maieſty ſo farre forth expedient welfare according alſo ſhe weth himſelfe v meanes lord ieſus chriſt vntill may come full perfect ſight ſhalbe laſt day wee ſhall ſee face face ſuch wiſe ſhall fully faſhioned like vnto glory may pleaſe graūt grace v alſo people nation c xlix sermon first vpon thirtenth chapter 1 behold mine eye hath ſeene theſe thing mine eare hath heard vnderſtoode 2 knovve much inferiour 3 vvill ſpeake vnto god reaſon vvith 4 yee bee forger lye phiſitions value 5 vvould hold tung ſhould counted vviſedome 6 heare diſcourſe vnderſtand vvhat debate 7 neede alledge iniquitie god defence ſpeake vntruth ſake 8 vvill yee pleaſure vvill yee pleade cace 9 good ſhould allovve ſhould vſurpe vpon vpon man 10 vvill reproue fauour ſecrete euell thing euerye v ſet himſelfe bee inferiour companion haue ſonde deſire ſeeme coūted wiſe poſsible ſame ſhall ingender much ſtrife among v paule alſo ſpeaketh vayngloriouſneſle sea welſpring debate men ſhal neuer agree quietly among thēſelues except euery man yeelde meekely whiche good reaſonable bee voyde deſire aduance himſelfe aboue others euery v ſo fond ſteppe eſteemed fire muſte needes kindled hande furthermore wee ſee howe scripture telleth v wee muſt eſteeme gyfts god thoſe haue receyued vvherefore let euery man thinke vpon owne infirmity ſinnes make v ſtoupe eſteeme thoſe whome haue preſumptuouſly ſhaken let v afraid god wrōg deſpiſing ſuch vtterly deſtitute gracious gyftes ſeemeth heere iob mente preferre hymſelfe ſpoken vnderſtand much ſayeth inferior mine eare hath hearde theſe thing mine eye hath ſeene ſeemeth iob would haue reputation wiſedome skilfulneſſe thoſe three whome ſpake ledde deſire prayſe ſo bycauſe theſe men woulde beare downe theyr preſumptuouſneſſe yea peruerte god truthe theyr owne fancye iob therefore conſtreyned ſay vnderſtoode thoſe thing better doth end theſe men able profit thē ſelues ſhould humbling vntill ſuch tyme men bee made ſtoupe ſo lowe may bee puffed vp ſayde preſumptuouſneſſe impoſsible wynne thing theyr hande euer man ſhewe ſette muche themſelves man mynde make himſelfe fit heare god truthe receyue muſte humbled afore thing whereat iob ameth muche whome hee talked bene hardened ſettled blinde ouerweening theyr owne wiſedome iob wyll haue truthe hearde ceaſſe haue authoritye ſtyll notwithſtanding theſe men reiect thus ye ſee iobs meening effecte according heerevntoo wee ſee sainct paule forced ſometimes make compariſon betweene himſelfe thoſe eſtimation among men certayne sainct paule prouoked thereto vaynegloriouſneſſe nother hee ledde ſuch minde deſire couet eſteemed among men vvhy cōpareth hee himſelfe ſuche bone wont magnifie themſelues hebrewes ſayth ſo auncient linage alſo may well account pedegree bee earneſt follower lawe ſo well haue liued without blame boaſt thē ſelues haue knowledge alſo haue beene well taught frō childhood haue good mayſter ſeemeth paule gathereth togyther thing wont eſteemed end men ſhould clap hand take greate man ſet muche ſtore hee ment ſuche thing hee himſelfe auoucheth bee ſtarke folly vvell ſayeth compell mee play foole ſpred wing bee medling euery thing magnified among men fayne ſayeth deale ſo mine owne ſaw corinthian ſuch like ſorepoſſeſſed fonde reputation men nothing worth loued none ſuch manner teacher bycauſe ytching eares meanes wherof god goſpell deſpiſed thoſe troubler theyr full ſcope nother wiſedome diſcretion conſider profit ſuffered themſelues led ſuch nothing fayre glozings without holineſſe paule perceyuing telleth theſe maner men purchace themſelues eſtimation thoſe meanes may ſo wel wil thing wherin muſt eſteemed according concludeth end mā coūted god church muſt become new creature ye ſee ſayeth hee eſtimation god hand theſe braueries wherwith men head buzied neuertheleſſe paul ſee ment ſhew inferiour thoſe pretended greate ſtyles bee ſome preheminence dignitie worldward ſame maner iob doth hee ſawe thoſe men mēt treade god truth vnder foote bicauſe reputation iob part telleth hee vnderſtoode thing well therevpon purpoſed warne lowly yeeld themſelues teachable although beene vtterly vnamendable ſtubborne folly yet neuertheleſſe iobs mind god truth bene maner preuerted ſhould haue full authoritie deſerueth thus much cōcerning firſt poynt way muſt warned ſeeke prayſe reputation afore men intende certayne ſtead mainteyning truth ſhall marre god alſo ſuffer v ſotted folly bee made laughing ſtocke let v bee well ware ſeeke owne prayſe lord giueth v grace teach others let ſame tende marke namely honour cauſe thing well accepted cōmeth ſo men may ſubmit themſelues vnto wee ſelues ſhewe example others ſo according alſo oure lorde ieſus chriſte ſetteth ſame thing downe marke diſcerne good true doctrine man ſeeketh glory god men know thereby miniſter truth deſire exalted eſteemed muſt needes diſguiſe marre pure doctrine muſt needes defaced vayngloriouſneſſe marke ſpeciall poynt nowe let v come whiche iob ſayeth yee ſayeth hee forger lye aud pelting phiſitions woulde fayne ye ſhoul • hold tung moste wiſedome vvhen iob calleth forger lye ſpoken afore wee ſee ſtrayte wayes purpoſe ſayeth nowe lette v take ſaying added namely thei pelting phiſitiōs vvhy ſo bicauſe miſapplye medicine wee haue ſeene hath beene tolde already doctrine whiche hath bene ſet downe theſe men good holy howbeit ill applied perſon iob phiſition ſhoulde choze good drug yet without knowing party diſeaſe complexion nature ſhould ſay lo good medicine well tryed therefore ſhall doo man good hee deale ſo whereas ſaueth one hee ſhall kyll another therefore behooueth phiſition bee wiſe hee knowe pacients complexion diſeaſe theſe men heere ſuche regarde thus yee ſee iob called pelting phiſitions value beholde heere text well woorthie bee marked vve knowe god woorde ordinarie foode oure soules yet muſt ſame ſerue v alſo phiſicke wee diſeaſed breade hath alwayes accuſtomed vſe god woorde muſte onely feede v muſte furthermore heale diſeaſes clenze v therfore muſt diſcretion vſed applying without ſhall confounde howe poore man bee deſolate haue troubled conſcience ſee poynt deſpayre one ſhould ſet god threatnings vengeance afore el ſend headlong forward ſee wall ſhaketh alreadie beate greate ſtrokes 〈…〉 attocke next way throw downe muſt wee marke bee diſpoſed whome wee haue doo poore man bee already diſmayed god wrath know become need bee comforted cheered vp promiſes god giueth wretched ſinners calling ſo ſweetely medicine muſt applyed peculiarly ſuche haue neede others ſhameleſſe deſpiſe god ſcoffe euer ſayd man come cocker offering mercy god ſetting afore pitie god hathe v fooliſhe proceeding ſuche folke haue neede bee touched quicke bee threatned yea wounded euen bottome hart bee poſsible may knowe ſtomake wiſe agaynſt god wee ſee holy scripture beyng ſpirituall phiſicke ſoules muſt applyed according euery man diſpoſitiō let v marke ſtate iob hee extremely preſſed affliction god ſente wee haue ſeene reaſon namely behoued pacience bee exerciſed god gyueth pacience howbeit hee ſhoulde haue muche infirmitie therewith like wretched man hee ſtarteth ſquare caſteth forth bubble froth agaynſte god leapeth quite boundes holdeth ſuche euenneſſe meaſure hee oughte haue done thē ſoeuer caſe ſtoode infirmity iob knew wel ynough god afflicted howbeit foraſmuch ſawe cauſe thought god preſſed ſore hee oughte haue ſpared doe come comforte tell god rightuous true herevpō cōclude god puniſheth men without good cauſes handling thē ſo roughly reaſon ſinnes true miſapply particularly cōcluding god handleth euery man according deſert ſee flat cōtrary general principle good true draw euill cōſequence although god iuſt men ſinners haue deſerued yet doth follow god puniſheth therafter ful kepeth one continuall rate ſo ſhould preſently puniſhe thoſe haue offended reſerue nothing tyll latter daye alſo followeth iob wicked man hypocrite god ſhewed euidently ſhaken nothing elſe hypocriſie theſe thing falſe notwithſtanding theſe men take deriue true grounde ſo yee ſee wherefore iob calleth pelting phyſitions ſtreyne warneth v pray god gyue v wiſedome may take holy scripture ſuch end perteyneth wee may haue diſcretion applie ſuche wiſe wee may good bee pulled fro toppe ſay according manie men abuſe furthermore wee take hand teache neyghbours let v conſider well fit holye scripture ſayeth paule fit teache incourage warne reproue redreſſe yea muſte bee conſidered maner one partie muſte applyed vnto ſayde afore wee ſee poore ſinner caſte downe mourneth ſinnes deſireth nothing returne vnto god let ſhewed god ready accept receyue yee ſee howe wee ought deale behalfe contrarywiſe wee ſee one proude ſtatelye wee knocke vppon harde parte beetle make meeken himſelfe god wee ſee ſlouthfull perſone hee muſte bee pricked forewarde like aſſe thus yee ſee howe holy scipture maye bee profitable v meane ſeaſon wee muſte alſo keepe ſame maner proceeding owne behalfe wee muſte bee ſame neyghbors wee ſelues vvee ſee theyr conſcience combered themſelues diſquieted mynde feede theyr owne humour take god threatenings ſo rygorouſly thinke ſhoulde neuer come ſoone ynough deſpayre lette v keepe v ſuche dealing wee ſpie satan wylineſſe making v beleeue vtterly paſte recouery helpe comforte v lette v reſiſt applye remedie therevnto satan woorketh therefore wee contrarye parte muſte ſeeke ſome aſſwagemente bring v backe vnto god wee muſte enter intoo promiſes wee muſte gyue heedefull eare vnto wee muſte ſet wittes vpon moreouer wee ſee much ſlouthfulneſſe ſelues ſo wee haue neede bee prycked ſpurred lette v take v exhortation holy scripture thus yee ſee howe may bee good phiſitions bothe towardes ſelues towardes oure neyghboures conſidering meete conuenient v touching iob ſayeth would fayne freendes woulde holde theyr peace myght bee counted wiſe men agreeth common prouerbe salomon vſeth whiche foole may bee counted wiſe hee holdeth peace true man neuer better hiding owne ſhame ſo long folly abides ſtill within nuriſhe priuilie neuertheleſſe beginning doo well man hathe holde himſelfe rule hys tung token delighteth altogither owne follie true ſome couer folly tyme ende bee fayne bewraye themſelues make menne knowe bee witte fooles neuertheleſſe man haue skill keepe ſilence although weake wit haue ſuch diſcretion requiſite yet greate poynt wiſedome knoweth fodeth himſelfe vice rather laboureth▪ amende ſay although ſuche follie remayne man yet greate poynt wiſedome auaunceth himſelfe knoweth himſelfe ſuch ſort miſliketh humbleth himſelfe man bewray himſelfe bee foole owne tung token ſtarke foole according often ſee ſuch haue leaſte skill babbling without reaſon ſo man cannot meanes hold hath talked whole houre togyther hee ſhall finde bee ſame men ſtill therefore men perceyued bee poynte ſigne extreme foly therefore let prouerbe put v minde iames telleth alſo wit greate vertue man skill holde tung vſe ſoberly wee bee haſtie ſpeake hindreth v frō hearing whiche oure pofit vvhat cauſe many men profit woorde god bycauſe haſtie whereas ought bee quiet whereas onely god ought haue hearing ſtep forth bubble caſte foorth talke yea euen randon therefore ſhet gate ſuche wiſe againſt themſelues cannot bee inſtructed though doctrine offered thē cauſe let v marke well whō iames counſeleth v brydle oure tung meening ſhould quiet diſcrete heare wee purpoſe profit ſayd vnto v among men muſt talkatiue wearie vnprofitable babbling muſt euery one v put vre needefull make long ſermons theſe ſuche thing ſhoulde rather continually minded ſet forth large manye woordes perceyue bee harde frame oure ſelues vnto ſame vertue ſo muche ought wee eſteeme man skill ſpeake muche hee ought nowe lette v come cheefe poynt touched heere iob ſayeth hee neuertheleſſe talke god hee reaſon blameth thoſe gone aboute ouercome theyr diſputations▪ ſhoulde ſay woulde ſpeake defence god thinke yee ſayeth hee god hath neede leazings ſhoulde come bee proctours aduocates hath neede men ſhould defende ſuche faſhion thinke ſhall auayle commeth try ye muſte bee ouerwhelmed pretence deſirouſneſſe iuſtifie hee ſhewe hee abhorreth ſuch dealing mainteyned owne rightuouſneſſe withoute borrowing anye meanes acquitted men hand without borrowing theyr leazings excuſes ſhall haue forged vvhereas iob ſayeth hee talke god diſpute againſt verely ſome excuſe ſaying lette v alſo marke good wee maye diſcerne euill beholde good ſaying iobs wyll turne awaye men whome doo perceyued ſpirituall battell himſelfe could haue found harte haue indured hundred time ſo god ſweetened ſtripes ſuch comfort hee might haue knowen god fauourable neuer faile iob bene throughly perſwaded god hylde mighty hande doubt hee bene ready haue iudured hundred tymes foraſmuche perceyued perceyued nothing god rigour ſo ſeemed god vtterly agaynſt perſecuted extremitie woteth behold wittes ſuche ſpirituall battels eaſie bee knowen men therefore iob ſayeth bee talke god ſaye hee ſhrinke himſelfe ſo gathered cloſe ſecrete hee holde himſelfe men take theſe word randon wreſt liſt themſelues god knoweth well ynough ende ſpeaking tendeth marke ſpeciall poynte let v alſo marke cace ſtandeth vpon framing ſelues vnto pacience indure aduerſitie muſt comfort ſelues god wee bee tryed ſo diuell tempteth thruſteth v forewarde deſpayre nothing ſo good gather oure wittes home ſo ſo long wee gaze men wee ſhall nothing auayle whiche wee ſhall ſelues harme bee troubled well cōforte ſelfe fayre ſhewes onely make greate proteſtations men god laugh fondneſſe ſcorne ſo much come ſelfe agayne alone conſcience pinche mee ſhall feele euer pretended ſmoke bicauſe haue regarde men god man intendeth frame himſelfe vnto pacience good withdraw himſelfe ſeparated frō whole worlde referre himſelfe wholly vnto god ſuffer himſelfe bee gouerned truly ſeing ſuch neceſsities haue good cauſe call vpon god ſhall call vpon bee cut men ſo long faſtened ſo long turned aſyde god vvee ſee muſt cut thoſe cordes hold v backe preſent ſelues maieſtie god partie whome wee haue regard true muſte regarde neyghbours alſo bothe edifie receyue comfort handes meane whyle wee muſte beginne poynt wit laying open hart god disburden matter ſorowes care vnto yee ſee howe talking god muſte bee ende men drawe v hither thither like god ſeeth v ſo wee haue eye ſettled faſtened vpon alone hidden harte maye bee clenzed voyded away wee bee come poynte appeered fore thus yee ſee good wee haue gather theſe woordes iob howe bee profitable oure inſtruction alſo euill hee enter diſputation god true ſometimes god giueth v leaue reaſon yea oure diſputings muſte bee long beſides concluſion muſte alwayes bee glorifie howe vvee ſee prophet finde fault calamity deſolations ſawe ſay lorde howe bee thou ſhouldeſt deſtroye thy people wilt thou ſuffer thing confounded ſorte wilt thou neuer ſet order thus yee ſee one kinde diſputing reaſoning god yea prophet holy men reſted poynte bewrayed infirmity maner alwayes concluded thou therwith diſpoſe thou thereof according thy wonderfull wiſedome v replie againſt thee therefore wee paciently wayte ſhall become thy worke true wee bee ſore amazed nowe wee ſee thing go ſuche confuſion yet notwithſtanding lorde thou wilt prouide well ynough ſuche wiſe thy name maye bee prayſed vntill ſuche time bee ſet order agayne ſhrinke head groūd according ſayde lay mouth duſte sainctes muſte bee humbled wiſe leremie horrible extremitie hee ſaide ſo ſaw vtter deſolation god churche ſo muche couenant ſeemed bee aboliſhed whole ſeruice turned vpſide downe hope whole worlde buryed therefore ieremie made moane hee ſayeth hee lay mouth grounde rather eate duſte dung lifte vp beake lette tung large agaynſt god yee ſee howe lawfull v ſometime reaſon god howbeit ſo bee mildly winding vp bee haue ſayde witte glorifie god referring oure ſelues wholly vnto lo effect wee haue marke lette v come backe agayne iobs perſone intendeth diſpute againſt god maner ſuche ſorte althoughe knowe double rightuouſneſſe god witte ſame manifeſted v law keepeth hidden yet hee coulde conceyue cauſe god tormented ſorte ſeemed god ought haue borne therefore diſputing iob vexeth himſelfe paſsion farre ſquare diſputation ioyned dependeth vppon ye ſee iob doth amiſſe condemned reaſoning ſort god let v marke well whenſoeuer god handleth v roughly wee tempted grudge fret againſt muſte bridle ſelues true haue ſayd god beareth v vtter griefes vnto ſay ala lord thou • eeſt cā lōger hold ſhal thus mee euer muſt yet linger ſtill longer time vve may ſay make ſuch moanes god hath giuē v ſuch libertie yet haue v neuertheleſſe conclude thus lord thine thou ſhalt v pleaſeth thee v glorifie thee reſpects lo wee haue marke matter concerneth oure perſons alſo generally ſhall ſeeme v god woorkes haue reaſon example wee ſee greate ſtumblings wicked haue full ſcope god prouide good ſuffereth afflicted without giuing eaſe wee ſay god hath declared ayde thoſe call vpon ſee cleane contrarie vve ceaſſe haue recourſe vnto yet hee deafe prayer wee offer vntoo agayne hath promiſed defend church behold left vp ſpoyle vve ſee horrible tirannie beareth ſway god hād ſhould ſuccour thoſe doth hee ſhew himſelfe willing maynteyne owne cace men ſee church openly oppreſſed enemy religion reigne adayes ſuch outrage pitifull ſee yet god repreſſeth ſuch temptation come minde let v learne get v awaye fal reaſoning god thus ye ſee haue marke vpon ſtreyne let v come ſecond poynt iob ſayeth thoſe whiche ſpoken mente currye fauour god wee woulde ſupport mortall man hebrew word ſet ſignifieth like accept one face perſone vvhat cauſe accept perſons matter iudgemēt world though man haue euill cace yet hee kinſman freende commended vnto v may looke profit hande authoritie well moued ſuch fleſhly regard towardes wee bee ſo caryed away cace partie nothing v fauoure blindeth v alſo worde face perſone referred outwarde thing may ſerue incline mindes eyther louing hating man thus doth iob ſpeake ſeemeth god hath neede helpe ſupporte mortall man hath euill cace truely one bee minded ſhewe fauour ſay kinſman hee freende commended mee hee hath pleaſured wil pleaſure herevpon diſguiſeth thing ſuche ſorte hee proceedeth ryght equitie indirectly beſeeche ſayth iob hath god neede hilde vp wiſe ſupported maner men behooueth v marke well poynt god haue cace hādled ſo abhorreth accepting perſons vve know telleth v wee iudge rightly wee muſt turned quite cleane away worldly reſpects thoſe conſiderations vtterly bereeue v vprightneſſe diſcretion wee ought haue howe happeneth man maketh lawe hee make reaſonable hee ſitteth iudge cace oftentimes giue forked ſentēce hee maketh lawe hee hath eye vpon matter looketh vnto vprightneſſe hee cannot turne aſide hee ſhoulde followe whiche good true menne haue conſideration yet wee haue reſpecte vnto men man propounde cace vnto v ſuche wyſe perſones bee medled wee iudge vprightlye cace layde naked afore v twoo party come v one bee riche kinne bee ſome like reſpect poore man ſo well recommended vnto v iudge caryed awaye yea reuerſeth matter euen cace hath beene layde open hee hath gyuen ryght iudgement vpon perſones bereeue vprightneſſe whiche hee alſo yee ſee lorde ieſus chriſt ſayeth iudge yee truely accepting perſons hee ſheweth bee fore poſſeſſed humane affection whyther bee hatred ſauoure pronounce good vnpartiall ſentence thing cannot matche togither paſsions doo caſte v ſuche darkneſſe wee ſee right wee yee ſee god condemneth accepting perſons ſay reſpect regard haue men cace ſo god haue accepting perſons among men vtterly abhorreth take good woorth towardes himſelfe ſeeing hee hath neede vndoubtedly hee wee ſee iobs meening nowe remayneth wee knowe profite doctrine profitable man woulde thinke hath put practize let v take example whiche wee ſee theſe dayes oure eye doo halfe ſtabliſhe freewill may better pleade cace againſte god lette menne followe thing purely whiche holye scripture ſheweth v ſayde men naught frowarde cannot ſo much thinke good thought ſo muche ſtirre one finger doo good bee bondeſlaues ſinne thought nothing elſe conſpiracie agaynſte god theyr affection enemy goodneſſe lo holye scripture telleth vs▪ inferre heerevppon yea ſo wherefore hath god giuen v lawe wherein requireth wee ſhoulde loue harte minde oure ſtrength power wee bee giuen vp euill dooth god commaunde v doo well playne mockerie otherſome ſay ſeeing wee good wee excuſed ſinne ought bee imputed vnto v excepte wee bee able abſteyne seeing power v followeth ſinne worlde heerevpon ſteppe ſticklers whiche woulde fayne play philoſophers defende god cleere theſe ſlaunders ſay true wee bee weake wee doo nothing vnleſſe god helpe v grace readie v take wee may make auaylable faulte bee oure ſelues beholde howe men deſirous curry fauoure god defacing doctrine holye scripture thoughe god ſtoode neede vntruthes alſo god election vvhen men ſaye god chooſeth whome thinketh good leaueth reſidue vnknowne hee doth ſauing ſo pleaſeth wil ought ſuffiſe v finall concluſion thoſe whome god hath chozen haue conſider goodneſſe mercie touching thoſe forſaken be▪ mirrours vengeance men ſpeake manner according scripture nowe beholde howe malicious ſorte ranckle ſpewe blaſphemies againſt god yea ſay chooze whome liſteth accepter perſones vvhy doth chooze one rather verely ſhoulde ſay god regarded fayre eye choozing v cauſe ſprang himſelfe ſay owne meere goodneſſe yee ſee howe men alwayes deſyrous checke agaynſt god herevpon come theſe ſticklers ſpake qualifie matter ſay muſt ſay god doth ſort chooze thinketh good ſhoulde giue wicked men occaſion runne oute ſquare wee muſte rowe betweene bothe ſtreames content one well vvell ſay true god choozeth thoſe whome hee foreſawe bee diſpoſed receyue grace ſide looke whome foreknewe bee wicked woulde bee better choozyng dooth hee leaue ſuche bee knowing well ynough would vndone owne freewill thus yee ſee howe wicked ſorte doo ſpeake god election euen peruerting truth yet beare themſelues hande god liketh well ſo let v rather aſſure ſelues god abhorreth text ſheweth v ſo yee ſee vſe muſte apply doctrine minde fare better surely deſerueth layde forth length ſo ſhalbe god willing nowe tyme ſuffer man ſay let v caſte ſelues downe preſence oure good god acknowledgemente oure ſinnes praying humble v ſuch wiſe conuicted offending diuers wayes may ſeeke nothing fauour afflict v time vſe ſuche rigour may ſeeme exceſsiue vnto v yet wee maye ſtill keepe mouth ſhet wayting pacientlie till hee deliuer v trouble meane ſeaſon wee may giue due glory acknowledging authoritie hath ouer v creature may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation c l sermon ſecond vpon thirtenth chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon vij viij ix x verſes followeth 11 doth maieſtie amaze doth feare fall vpon 12 remembrance like vnto aſſhes body body clay 13 holde tung peſence lette mee ſpeake let happen mee vvhat 14 vvherefore ſhould take fleſh teeth put ſoule handes 15 although kill mee yet vvill truſt neuertheleſſe vvill reproue vvayes hys ſight haue go forward matter wee began yeſterday ſcripture ſheweth v many thing vnderſtāding cānot brooke man ſpeaketh v maner cōcerning god ſuche ſcornfulneſſe v ſeeming wee bound receyue thing finde good herevpon haue bene ſome would fayne play wyze men diſguiſing thing end might wel liked according alledged two example yeſterday one cōcerneth freewill beholde scripture telleth v namely men cā good hilde prizoners altogither vnto euill many opiniō ſo thē ſinners excuſed quit aſmuchas haue power good forger lye whiche rowe betweene two ſtreames ſay better graunt men ſome freewill intent maye bee blameworthie haue doone amiſſe yea scripture ſpeaketh otherwiſe vvherefore flee ſuch ſtartingholes forge leaſings curry fauour god hath hee neede theyr lie muſte trueth bee mainteyned meane much bee ſayde thoſe darken god grace hath chozen thought good creation world reiected reſt howe ſore poynte wee ſee many men haue ſtumbled yee ſee theſe sage alledge yet meane whyle ſteppe like ſticklers ſaying ſay god hath chozen thoſe ought ſaued bycauſe hee foreſawe would well diſpozed therevnto therefore aſmuch hee foreknewe woulde bee ready receyue grace hee marked hee might ſay theſe myne dooth scripture ſpeake ſo ſpeaketh cleane contrarie ſayeth god fyndeth v alike hee putteth difference betwixt v nother barrell better herring v ſauing god owne infinite goodneſſe draweth v oute death thus yee ſee pure ſimple doctrine holy scripture vvherefore doo men come brabble heere tolde becauſe thinke excuſe god yea muſte god bee fayne borrowe oure lye muſt bee ſpokeſmen oure wrangling trickes lyke wee ſee euill caſes neede well coloured altogyther turkined maye ſo bleare eye iudges may bee able knowe nothing needefull woorke faſhion god behalfe let v marke well howe ſayde wee ſhall haue ſought corner witte colour men would elſe reiect condemne intent might bee article holye scripture might miſliked god cōdemne v ſuch ſophiſticall inuentions extendeth yet wee ſee howe many daye would fayne medling make meane betwixt v papiſtes verely ſay true many abuſes churche cōfeſſe thing ouergroſſe vnable borne withall therfore needefull haue reformation wil confeſſe meane ſeaſon bee demaunded preache finde fault peece fault doctrine follow pure ſimplicitie goſpell withoute adding diminiſhing notwithſtanding▪ ſee reiected many men cannot agree hard matter reforme thing hande ſmooth men ſo gentle bee dealt withall herevpon finde forge deuiſe ſay beſte holde meane betweene bothe wee ſawe interim vvhat hath bene cauſe bring v diueliſhneſſe onely deuiſers deſirous play alchimiſtes multiplier find new quinteſſence wote haue bene ſufficiently cōuicted poperie nothing horrible confuzion thing ouerfarre order idolatrie groſſe may bee ſeruing god vtterly defaced wee ſee men put truſte owne deſeruings haue imagined ieſus chriſte buryed trotted sainct sainct haue theyr patrones god sacramentes ſet oute gaze vpon make chaffer marchandize men ſoules impute pelting trifle ceremony meete ſo muche make idol yee ſee theſe neuter know well ynough neede bee remedied wiſe ſaye thing theſe lutheran haue deſired hithertoo manner impoſſible worlde cannot abyde ſuche alteration therefore neede bee ſome meane yea mary true men haue corrupted god ſeruice leaning hath beene commaunded men therefore requiſite obedience ſake men ſhoulde bee bounde doo ſo ſtill howbeeit bee bounde ſo greate penaltie ſo ſtrayghtly agayne men haue truſted muche merites woorkes therefore muſte bee ſayde nowe ought beginne god grace ſame cheefe piller wherevpon reſte vvhereas ieſus chriſt hath beene good bodie men haue reſorted grace hee muſte bee declared bee aduocate yea cheefe aduocate oure onely aduocate men may mingle theyr owne merites grace god men commaundementes muſte alwayes bee obſerued ſome manner alſo men muſte ceaſſe haue deceaſſed sainctes bee theyr aduocates ſo maye fellowe commiſsioners ieſus chriſt worſhipping image men bee ſo ſotted may well ſayde image ſtirre vp deuotion ignorant ſimple ſort verely ouer groſſe folly gadde pilgrimage yet meane men may keepe ſtill ſome deuotion weake ignorant touching sacrament men may well ſhewe ought ſo greate eſtimation men ought knowe ought make account them▪ remembrance chriſte yet men may conceyue wote maſſe well ſhal ſo much aduaunced men ſhall haue particular maſſes deade honour ſuche sainct thing ſhall bee common maſſe men ſhall ſaye ſtill sacrifice ieſus chriſt true prieſt offereth himſelfe god father maſſe ſhall repreſent death paſsion ieſus chriſte lo howe theſe leazing forger haue ſurmized themſelues worke politikely making ſuche medlye ende goſpel might rough worlde cō trary part ſayde god ayded ſerued leazings vvhat bee done then▪ lette v walke ſoundly plainely let v haue mouthes ſhet ende hath ſpoken may hold ſelues proceedeth mouthe without replying thervnto behold ſay howe wee may allowed hand cōdemne v ſhifts thinke purchaſe fauour owne fancie ſtep neuer ſo little aſide pureneſſe worde misfaſhion iudgementes though neuer ſo ſtraunge man imagination let v come added dooth maiestie amaze doth feare fall vpon ſayeth iob afterward addeth memoriall like aſſhes body bodie clay hereby meneth lie god behalfe muche ſaye conceyue maieſtie would make like ſelues pull downe hither wee hayle fellowe well met beholde pray driueth men vvhy ſo ſhameleſſe falſifying god truth bicauſe would meaſure owne ſpanne oddes betwixte god v let v learne conceyue manner one maieſtie god thervpon let v ſo fooliſhe deſire incroch thing either vpon worde vpon iudgementes let v looke downe heades lette god ſay pleaſeth wee haue hearde worde let alſo doo hee thinketh good let v honour woorkes ſpecially wee enter conſideration oure owne feebleneſſe frayltie ſaye wee thus yee ſee two thing iob compareth togyther heere firſt ſayeth doth maieſtie god amaze vvhen hee ſpeaketh maieſtie dignitie hee ſheweth men ought bee ſomewhat better aduiſed talke god vvee ſteppe bluntly ſeemeth v god ſuffer men play addeth immediatelye therefore wee ſpeake god let v learne conceiue infinite glory haue conceyued cannot wee muſte bee humbled ſaye ala ſpeaking god manner men making compariſon ſhoulde made him▪ woulde wee ſet degree woulde place vvoulde haue matched creature aſmuche make thing nothing ſhall become maieſty men haue abaced ſort▪ wit conceyue taſt god infinite glory certaine ſhoulde learne humble ſelues vnderneath ſame ſo ouerweening make ſelues beleeue furthermore let v bethinke ſelues feebleneſſe wretchedneſſe man nature giue far greater gloſſe god maieſtie inſomuch muſte needes bee magnified wee knowe throughly wee ſelues v glory angelles ſhoulde approche neerer vnto god yet ſhoulde faine angel according ſayd thē vnder ſhape cherubins fayne hyde face able looke vpon god throughly true scripture ſayeth ſee god face howe ſeeing able abyde withoute caſting downe theyr eye withoute couering theyr face theyr wing ſay able doo without baſhfulneſſe reuerencing god ſoueraine vnto whome able atteyne withoute acknowledging ſame highneſſe humble thēſelues therevnto lo angelles heauen fare wee rottenneſſe touching ſoules bee little ſparkes whiche ſhoulde bee quenched paſſe away intoo ſhadow god preſerueth ſtate hee owne meere goodneſſe haue wee ſelues power ſtande one minute hower god muſt fayne preſerue v bycauſe nothing v ſmoke vanitie vvhen knowe certaine preſumptuouſneſſe well beaten downe v ſo ſhall haue fooliſh deſire diſputing owne maner paynt god colour according wee ſee disfigured rent peeces men vve ſhall bee ſo preſumptious malaparte wee knowe glorie haue well bethought v weakeneſſe oure ſelues thus yee ſee ſorte wee ſhall bee aſtoniſhed feare iob ſpeaketh heere impoſſible knowledge god ſhould bee ydle men ſhoulde caſt downe ſuche wiſe durſt bee ſo bolde babble god haue ſpoken ſo randon token neuer knewe felte maieſtie ſayde afore liuelye feeling wee vnderſtande god hath created v wee whether looke vpwarde downward thing hand wonderfull rightuouſueſſe wiſedome hid v incomparable goodneſſe wee knowe theſe thing cannot bee muſte needes bee aſtonied abaſhed ſelues ſo ſhall vtterly abace ſelues honour highneſſe infinite let v learne know better god ende may trayned modeſtie ſoberneſſe therewithall alſo let v examine ſelues vvhen ſee owne fleſhe doth tickle v like well ſelues ſo wee inclined flatter ſelues ſeeke ſtande owne conceyte let v ſtirre vp ſelues ſay whence commeth vice bycauſe thou haſte yet knowne thy ſelfe conſider thou art enter thy ſelfe iudge thine owne ſtate ſhall finde haue bottomleſſe gulfe ſinfulneſſe v bee wrapped ſuch ignorance horrible behold ſo thicke darkneſſe vtterly choketh ſtrangleth v ſo far hauing eye open knowe god wee ſee thing oure noze▪ therefore whē men ſhall haue thought themſelues wiſe certaine ſhall ſo touched maieſtie god whereas ſeene full pryde harebraynd fearing god ſo reuerence modeſty feare god ſhall fall vpon ſteade greate ſtraunge faſtneſſe bee ſeene world men ſhall find reuerent awe god ſayde wee haue conceyued god wee ſhall ſtoope vnder agayne otherſide wee ſee oure ſelues wee ſhall haue cauſe ſtande oure owne conceyte aduaunce ſelues manner wiſe thus yee ſee iob mente token theſe twoo ſentences greater confirmation hee ſayeth yea thinke hee wyll beare yee dally man hee ſheweth v heerein men beguiled knowing maieſtie god honour ſame ought doo doo dally vvhereas ought honour wee play bee wont play dealing one another hee deceyue ſticketh deceyue well ynough ſo bee perceyued like conuey wyles among men ſo alſo woulde make couin paſſe good payment godwarde greate abuſe therfore let v thinke dallie ſuch crafteſmayſter ſcape vnpuniſhed althoughe god ſuffer men runne • yote tyme yet ende hee miſſe ſhewe hee partie tooke another manner man hee partie tooke bee bycauſe hee lyke creature ought obedient common rule ſuche wiſe may bee brought accounte meaſured lawe hee hath gyuen vnto v vnto v ſay hath ſquared law bee meetyard bee ſubiect himſelfe heerewithall alſo men muſt vnderſtand hee another manner one haue imagined bee haue eye infinite glorie therefore let v beware dallying god ſheweth v whenſoeuer treate eyther worde woorkes wee muſte go good earneſt nowe iob ſayth holde tongue afore mee ſpeake let befall mee heere iob ſheweth hee like theſe babbler skirmiſhe god worde iudgementes howe bee aloofe handeſtrokes according yee ſhall ſee ſome haue tung well fyled talke ſhall onely debate trifling queſtions farre pracize iob ſheweth himſelfe none thoſe ſo ſee ſayth hee howe carie fleſhe betweene teeth torne peeces fayne take vp fleſhe skinne teeth carie haue ſoule ſaythe hee betweene handes sith ſee mee ſuch plight thinke prate like popiniay cage forced ſpeake heart god examineth mee holding mee vpon racke muſte needes vtter affection playnely mee ſpeake one hath experience god tryeth mee ſuch maner well ſeene haue leyſure colour matter ſpeake one thing another therefore let ſpeake ye ſhall beare burthen god whome haue deale hee alſo whome haue anſwere ſo youre diſcourſes leaue ſo much bee worth ſaye vtterly vnprofitable tryfling toyes mee ſpeake according god ſheweth mee hee ſheweth mee effecte thus yee ſee breefely iob meant ſay let v marke heere manner ſpeeche hee vſeth namely hee holdeth fleſhe betweene teethe carie hee rente peeces mannes skinne torne hee wiſt doe take vp betwixte teeth yee ſee iob telleth plyght hee thereby hee ſheweth himſelfe haue bene ſo pitifull cace hee like liuing creature vvhereas hee ſayth hee holdeth ſoule life betweene handes muche ſaye ſame vtter hazarde abandoned lefte vp ſpoyle heerein man may ſee doltiſhneſſe papiſtes haue ſurmyzed holde one ſoule betweene handes ſignified haue power doe good euill let men deuize liſt ſaye haue ſoule myne owne handes ſay doe thinke good haue free ſtate bee ſhorte meant builde free vpon ſentence haue ray ſoule betweene handes know god threatneth men hee tell hee leaue owne hande ſoreſt ſcourge light vpon beholde god thundereth v ſayth hee leaue v vp owne hand god hold v backe remedie wee muſt needes runne headlong intoo deſtruction therefore wee ſee howe papiſtes beſotted wreſted scripture faſhion meaning verie cleere ſtreine iob ſayth hee beareth ſoule hande alreadie breathed oure ſoule clozed within oure body cheſt meane keepe wee hande one left randon iob declareth rather deade aliue god handleth ſuch wiſe like wretched rotten carkaſſe ſo liuelyneſſe become lothly men lo ſayeth hee knowe well taken bee companie menne eſteemed deade bodye heereby ſayde iob ſheweth ſpeculatiue teacher true practicioner thing ſpeaketh ſay god iudgements vndoubtedly without experience wee neyther knowe god hande power iuſtice thyng elſe true men ſhall bee tryed iob wit ſuche rigoure yet muſt come touchſtone diſcouer v haue nothing vaine ſpeculations god doe ſometymes ſummon v ſo wee maye feele ſinnes endleſſe death vnderſtande bee deſtitute ſaluation ſhet hope reſpect ſelues wee ſhall neuer know treate god aright ſay ſhall neuer knowe one iote heartie affection theſe trifling pratlers maye well haue ſtore fayre ſhewes may make bragges men ſhall bee ſteadineſſe wee deſirous ſpeake god earneſtly becommeth v requiſite v haue bene exercyſed aforehande haue come tryall it▪ ſay god haue nipped v ende may knowe ſelues thus yee ſee effect iob hath meent ſtreine reſt let v marke well oure lorde putteth v ſuch tryals wee neede greater ſtrength man ende may ſtand vpon hearing ſome iobs wordes wee woulde condemne good cauſe waye muſt conſider well extremitie hee intent may thinke ſtraunge though hee ſome temptation ouermayſtred hym albeeit ende withſtoode combates yet ſome feebleneſſe meane ſo hee maner quyte quayled althoughe fayth fell quyte downe yet ſhaken hee hadde ſome defaultes well felte behoued hym ouergoe ſuch temptation notwithſtanding ryght greeuous beare therefore lette v thinke ſtraunge ſpeeche man daye ſaye iob ſayde namely hee poore deſperate ſoule hee holdeth hys fleſhe hys skinne betweene teeth hee hath ſoule hand▪ true dauid ſpeaketh ſame manner hundred nyneteenth pſalme yet compariſon iob euen pittes bottome wee ſee wee looke vppon hee indured bodye ſeeing hee ſo broken man woulde diſdeyne looke vpon hym yea verye ſight ynough make mannes haire ſtande vppe vpon head hee become ſo hydeous thing would ſhame man yea loth heart beholde nowe iob indured theſe paynes bodie bene verie much cheefe poynt ſayde feeling god iudgement god perſecuted ſo much hee found fauour hand ſeemed god meant adde continually plague vpon plague till hee ſent bottome death damnation seeing iob layde ſo roughly let v thinke ſtraunge ſome temptation ſquare meete god ſhould poynte vtter perfectneſſe owne ſtrength infirmitie man let v oure ſide apply inſtruction firſte god ſende v ſo great exceſsiue affliction wee bee maner ſwallowrd vp let make v deſpayre ſhall bee declared yet full heereafter let v reſiſte knowing god doth ſtill reſerue mercie readie v time conuenient wee bee payned wee woulde wiſhe let v aſſure ſelues god let maladie rypen heale better man haue plague ſore well ſeene ſore ſtinketh ynough impayre health whole man yet hiſition surgion launce byle firſt daſh hee ſhould make firie bycauſe matter yet rype hee lay ſome drawing playſter fyrſte make ſore rypen afterwarde hee bee bolde launce euen ſo dealeth god v hee ſeeth wee haue verye noyſome plague ſores let v thinke ſtraunge hee healeth firſt daſhe diſeaſe muſt firſt bee made rype afterwarde god maye put hande fynde conuenient remedy let v aſſure ſelues god knoweth good conuenient v therefore let v tarie leyſure pacience wee bee egre making haſte wee endure anye affliction excuſe bee v specially ſythe wee ſee iob come gulfe hell yet neuertheleſſe humble himſelfe god▪ although hee endured ſo greeuous tormentes ſo exceſsiue ſorrowe yet hee reſtrayned ſelfe ſay man ſo puniſhed dyd ſtill brydle ſelfe praye ſhall wee bee vnexcuſable wee chafe fret oure ſelues aduerſities let v conſider theſe thinges let euery v haue eye ſelfe vvhen wee ſee ſuch ſeruant god hath bene tryed ſort vttermoſt wee muſt ſo much mylde aduerſities ſtomacke god wee haue beene wonte doe thus yee ſee wee haue beare mynde concerning ſtreyne iob ſayeth although god kill hym yet trust neuertheleſſe hee reprooue owne wa • e god preſence true hebrewe worde lo tranſlate maye bee taken ſo doth ſignifye properly nothwithſtanding ſome tymes taken relatiuely tearme one letter chaunged intoo another whiche common vſe among hebrewes neuertheleſſe meening one eyther wayes yee reade muſte bee waye demannding queſtion thus thoughe hee kill mee ſhall truſt hym yes ſtill truſt elſe yee read thoughe hee kill mee vvhen hee ſhall haue killed mee yet put truſte wee ſee ſubſtance matter chaunged bee ſhort iobs meening although hee bee ouerthrowne inraged paſsions yet muche ſay hath forgone pacience intendeth ſtād contention god alienate himſelfe quite cleane frō minded ſtomack matter ſuch wiſe haue vvherefore▪ proteſteth hopeth whatſoeuer come although hee kill ſaith confound yet ceaſe truſt neuertherleſſe reproue wayes ſight thus fayne intermeddle vehemencie ſee whiche perceiue ſay faine intermeddle hope haue god haue faire excellent mirrour god working ſuffereth faithful fal end faith may better tryed theſe thing ſeeme vnable matched togither themſelues god himſelfe maketh agree firſt bluſh man would ſay lo heere fire water laſt god bringeth al thing ſuch end diſagreement haue bene ſome whiche diſputations would fayne alwayes conclude manner philoſophers al thing ſo put order diſagreement certaine league couenant throughout thing ſuch men neuer knewe haue bene ſifted god haue paſſed iudgementes haue ſayd god handleth v ſuch ſtraunge faſhion thing confounded cace good ſooth thing v alſo neuer made agree ſome time deſirous liue ſometimes wee woulde fayne dye theſe thing contrarie yea reſpectes diuers ſayth saint paule naturally couet bee conſequently wee ſhunne death death horrible vs▪ bicauſe contrarie oure nature thing diſmayeth man part wee ſee wee bee hild heere priſon ſo long bodye oures compaſſeth v wee bondage ſinne therefore inforced ſyghe ſorie therewithall long euerlaſtingneſſe whiche promiſed v time god ſhall▪ haue taken v worlde wee drawe towarde death come wee death verie gate life aſſuring ſelues much ieſus chriſte hath paſſed ſame away wee neede bee afrayde death ſhall haue power ouer v rebated blunted ſwoord whereof point broken ſo cannot hurt v although draw ſome bloud v yet notwithſtanding ſame ſhall rid v diſeaſes ſhoulde ſeeme theſe affection contrarie ſo bee deede god agreeth verie well ſuche wyſe thing wee haue conceyued naturall wit put vnder foote bycauſe fayth getteth vpper hande muche ſayde iob handleth ſtreine ye ſee faythfull fully reſolued vpon pointe namely put truſt god hope ſaluation hande howe ſo euer hee would goe thing doe excepte hild father reſorted refuge ſhould ſay behold god hath bene father vttermoſt therewithall hath giuen leaue come vnto therefore muſte call vpon put ſelfe intoo keeping doubt alwayes mercifull vnto mee yea ſcourgeth mee mind come neere ſhall perceiue hath heard verely conceite hard comberſome beare yet muſt tary leaſure god pacience honor reſt ſelfe vpon promiſes lo howe faithfull fully reſolued point otherſide behoueth knowe themſelues vnpoſsible ſhould knowe owne infirmity muſt alſo make moane ſay theſe thing contrarie ought tarie god leyſure ſilence meete v make diſputing enter cō plaint ſo contrarie faith true contrarie firſte ſight god ſetteth one well ynough haue bene toſſed turmoyled ſome hartburning behold faith draweth v ſuch wiſe vnto ſtilneſſe finally wee conclude thus doubt goodneſſe god neuer forſake v howſoeuer world go ſhall always find fauorable althoughe hee ſhewe himſelfe ſo firſt brunt thus ye ſee haue gather effect vpon ſtreine nowe wee ſee whereat iob amed hee ſayde although god kill yet put truſt yet neuertheleſſe reaſon god reproue mine way hebrew word vſeth ſignifieth reproue alſo debate pleade ſaying proteſtation hee man party ſpoken toke toke ſuch one would haue played double quit woulde haue truſted god hee ſpoken thoſe thing diſpite god telleth none ſuch holdeth ſtill truſt god nowe ſeeing truſteth god muſt neceſsitie ſubmit himſelfe truſt god ſhrinke awaye holde one ſelfe aloofe contrariwiſe truſt god come vnto ſeemeth farre v euen ſtreine ſelues get therwithal moreouer holy ſcripture telleth v namely ſhroud ourſelues vnder ſhadowe wing returne vnto may receyue v lap child receyued father ye ſee conteined iob ſaith trust god continually ſheweth hee one theſe ſtragglers make outleaps bicauſe deſirous play horſes broken looce cleane contrarie ſaith deſire nothing neere ſhould haue hand vpon mee heereby hee cleared falſe ſlaunder charged withall yet neuertheleſſe ſaith afterward beholde yet muſte reaſon god concerning wayes ſay hope haue ſuch vtterly vnmingled complaintes ſo ſhould lift vp ſelfe murmure againſt god true proceedeth infirmitie yea euen ſinfull infirmitie worthy condemned howe ſo euer cace ſtande god letteth goe altogither ſayde afore faith ouerruleth affection vvhen wee truſte god call vpon much ſay wee ſhould neuer haue bickering ſelues fayth muſt get vpper hande peace whereof paule ſpeaketh muſt winne victorie ſay muſt get maiſtrie heart hee ſpeaketh peace god attributeth victory vnto ſheweth wel ſhall haue turmoylings v ſhall toſſed fro remedie ther peace god muſt ſuch power may get maiſtrie end paſsions brought awe let v marke well proteſting truſt god iob doth alſo cōfeſſe owne infirmitie ſhew ſo perfect alwayes ſome fault found yet neuertheleſſe hee fleeth alwayes god refuge sith cace ſtandeth ſo let v alſo ſide vnderſtād whē ſhakē prouocations fleſh owne affection ſomewhat carie v away muſte therefore deſpayre imagine god helpe v let v plucke vp oure heartes truſt although wee doe ſo perfectly requiſite yet let v ſure hee make v feele wayting vpon vayne hee ſtrengthen v continually faythe make ſame get vpper hand al temptation world preſent life let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele ſuche wiſe beeing aſhamed ſelues may labour haue oure recourſe mercie may pleaſe onely forgiue v fault paſt▪ alſo rid v miſeries wherein receyued protection cuſtodie wee may neuer ſlip howſoeuer satan practize againſte v hee neuertheleſſe bee alwayes ſo hande wee maye euer haue wherewith beate backe aſſaultes mortall enemie maketh vpon v may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules c lj sermon third vpon thirtenth chapter 16 vvill yet ſtill helpe hypocrite ſhall come face 17 herken vvords marke vvhat ſhall tell 18 vvhen ſhall haue ſet dovvne cace knovve ſhall iuſtified 19 vvho vvill plead againſt hold peace vndone 20 graunt theſe tvvo thing vvill hyde ſelfe thy ſight 21 vvithdravv thy hand let thy vvrath make afrayde 22 thou ſpeake vvill anſvvere elſe vvill ſpeake anſvvere thou haue ſeene alreadie proteſtation iob made witte hee woulde ſtill truſt god euen hee ouerwhelmed hande ſayde ſhewe howe hee deeper conceyte feeling god iudgement men commonly haue according wherevnto hee knewe double ryghtuouſneſſe god nowe confirmeth ratifieth ſame matter anewe ſaying god bee helpe yea hypocrite ſayeth hee ſhall come hee ſhould ſaye knowe preſent ſelfe god therefore ſure hath handled mee ſo hardly afflicted extremitie ſtill ſhew himſelfe sauiour vvherevpon doth iob ground hope welfare vpon hee dareth approch vnto god true hypocrite alſo approche vnto god according ſayde eyght fiftith eſay people ſeeketh daye daye preace would knowe wayes vvee ſee theſe hypocrite haue affection zeale neuertheleſſe make many windelaſſes martyr themſelues ſhould ſeeme nothing fire flame get neere vnto god yea doe nothing elſe turne potte bee deſirous come ſtreyght way vnto god would fayne bee quit without comming howe wee ſee howe hypocrite verie full deuotion buzy pretend therby vvhen papiſts heare three maſſes day make muche bibblebabble take holy water trot altar altar certayne pretende ſerue god pretending ſuch ſorte god beholdeth neere hande withdrawe themſelues ſtray farre away cauſe prophete ieremie likeneth theſe braueries theſe masking theſe ceremony among men vnto theeues caue like theefe retyreth couert ende might ſeene faulte come light euen ſo doe hypocrite make ſundrie colour lurkingholes euerie thing call ſeruice god ende god ſhould demaunde nothing let alone bee maye couer themſelues vnder mummerie thus ſee hypocrite make countenance approching vnto god howbeeit ſame bee truth therefore although bee puffed vp fonde miſweening yet neuer neerer vnto god although perke vp nebbes bolde make many proteſtations ſo muche ſeemeth would euen runne vpon god haſte yet come neuer neerer vnto ſo bycauſe beſotted thinke vpon god thought vpon god would bee ſo bolde vvee ſee hypocrite haue playde fooles owne fonde trifle dallied god little babie thinke themſelues rightuous angel faulte bee founde god demaunde thing hand doth preſſe much ſo farre beeing indetted vnto ſeeming beholden vnto ye ſee howe hypocrite flaſh fire flame ſuch ſort ſhoulde ſeeme would runne vpon god bycauſe thinke haue liuely feeling conſciences bee ſhort man ſhall neuer come god good hart pure free affection excepte hee honour honouring feare fearing truſte theſe thing ſay muſt man heart euer come vnto god haue acquaintance firſt poynt ſay honour god ſaye knowe maieſtie becommeth v yeelde ſelues wholly therevnto homage vntill wee haue conceyued maieſtie god aboue v ſhall neuer deſirous come vnto feare muſt alſo bee matched therewithall ſay haue graunted ſoueraintie dominion wee muſte bee deſirous ſerue walke commaundeth feare alone ynough therefore muſt learne knowe god goodneſſe wee may put oure truſt alſo meane come vntoo cauſe iob ſayth hypocrite neuer appeare god preſence ſay ſhunne god muche poſsible according alſo ſee ſpoken death torment themſelues yet notwithſtanding way come vnto god howebeeit vtterly eſchewe iob hee hath ſayde hypocrite come neere god proteſteth hee ſelfe none number proofe whereof hee commeth god yea ſeeth reaſoning mortall men therefore reſteth vpō leuer god ſhould herken might haue leaue ſpeake hee face hereby hee preſuppoſeth god bee helpe ſtill way wordes vſeth ſomwhat ſtraunge haue ſeene like heretofore ſhall ſee like hereafter howbeit end may haue true expoſition let v follow order hild heere hearken ye ſayth receyue woordes ſhall haue ſet downe cace knowe ſhall bee iustified iob preſuppoſeth hath ſo good reaſons defende himſelfe withall ſhall quitte god may haue leaue plead cace pleadeth men deale deafe eares would haue thoſe ſpeaketh holde peace heare hee ſhall debate wayte ende iſſue ſhall vttered god vvee ſee ſumme intent wit ment ſay ſhould bee quit myght haue leaue libertie debate cace wherevpon dependeth vvee muſt call mynde hath beene declared afore witte two ſortes god rightuouſneſſe god ſometimes iudge men lawe hath giuen v ryghtuouſneſſe whiche throughlye knowne apparant vnto v god doth enter couenaunt v giueth v rule marke howe haue men liue hee doth theſe thing curſed hee ſo euer performeth law ſhall liue seing lord hath ſo certifyed v hee hath ſhewed v rightuouſneſſe altogither apparant ſhould iudge v therafter ſhould fayne enter account examine life euery commaundement thinke ſelues go wherein haſt thou doone amiſſe behold thy god requireth ſuch thing haſt thou performed thou ſeeſt wherin thou art faultie marke ſay ſhall condemned law likewiſe contrarie part knowe ourſelues haue fulfilled god law vnpoſsible admit ſo ſay man trieth work throughly finde life hath bin conformable god law hee iuſtified rightuouſneſſe apparant knowne v yet iob hath proteſted heretofore higher rightuouſneſſe god whereby hee could condemne euen angelles vvherefore although god allowe man life throughly framed according lawe yet bound thereby neyther much ſaye owe ſeruice ſhould hold v acquit compare perfection god perfection creature wil come sunne may darkned though giue light al world ſay ther nothing ſuffize ſatiſfie matter let v marke well whē ſo euer god liſteth iudge v lawe although wee know euill vice ſelues yet ſhould wee bee rightuous let v come iob ſayth vvhen ſo euer ſhall haue leaue plead cace ſayth lay forth matter order alledge reaſons knowe ſhall iuſtified ſay god would iudge according lawe might anſwere ſhewe life hath bene ſhould iuſtifyed haue told impoſsible needes none proofe ſhew al men curſed damned god ſayth whoſoeuer performeth theſe thing ſhall bee accurſed vvhen paule goeth proue man ſhall iuſtified deedes lawe giltie god ſo mouthes muſt bee ſtopped hee alledgeth ſame ſentence yea doth follow therevpon damned vvee muſt looke whether god lawe paule preſuppeſeth wee ſay none whiche diſchargeth dutie v farre meeneth iob ſay hee ſhall iuſtified god would admit ſtand defence god wherof accuſe faultie thing knowe ſo much hee mortall man hee clothed many infirmity ſinnes doth hee meene hee could quit firſt wee muſt call mynde hath bene touched heretofore namely iob looketh ſimply deſeruing himſelfe god intent ſcourging howe vvee haue ſeene god findeth ſinnes v worthy bee puniſhed go hee beareth forgiueth yet meane afflict v ſome cauſe befell vnto iob true wretched ſinner god according lawe might haue puniſhed extremely yet notwithſtanding ſuche reſpect vve haue ſeene afore god puniſhed iobs ſinnes ſet purpoſe puniſhe ſhould ſay puniſh man bicauſe hee hath deſerued bycauſe hath liued naughtily god ſuch reſpect vvhat intended iob ſhould mirrour men end beholde may haue occaſion humble ourſelues knowing god hande heauie v beare alſo conſidering frailtie according ſecret incomprehenſible iuſtice hee might handle v hundred thouſand time roughlier doth therwithall alſo haue eye pacientneſſe man god ment vſe iob theſe matter ſo ſee intent puniſh cauſe iob ſaith leaue ſpeake open cace large ſhould found rightuous according god intent ſay reſpect preſent affliction endured god ſhould find iniquitie behalfe contrariwiſe allow one ſeruants iob ſo ſaying reiecteth forgiueneſſe ſinnes wherevpon rightuouſneſſe founded vve ſay men made rightuous faith bycauſe wee damned workes true bring damnation curſedneſſe god therefore muſt v abyde ſhame confuzion cauſe ſtandeth v hande borrowe rightuouſneſſe god maye like allowe thing done lord ieſus chriſt clotheth v owne rightuouſneſſe ſame allowed v god ye ſee become rightuous fayth bycauſe bee clenzed ſcoured ſinnes death paſsion oure lorde ieſus chriſte meane time god guideth v holy ſpirit guiding v accepteth ſeruice yeelde ſay accepteth goodneſſe hee hath put v ſo much one drop goodneſſe v giuen v aboue therfore like god giueth v gracious giftes ſo doth alſo take good worth howe workes pleaſe god hee hath eye imperfection thing v hath ſome blemiſhe god hee regardeth hee beareth v fatherly loue ye ſee may bee rightuous god yea verely inſomuch pleaſeth like well v hee bounde wee haue deſerued maner iob ſayth hee ſhall bee found rightuous whereby excludeth god grace mercie hee extendeth thoſe bearing handling rigourouſly calling life account poynt poynt heerewithall let v marke alſo iob ſpeaketh exceſsiuely hee hath doone afore vvhat reaſon hee man raueth one aſtraught hee woteth cauſe hee diſputeth god ſecret rightfulneſſe ouerrough therefore ſayth maruell though ſo troubled ſwallowed vp diſpayre ſeeing god perſecuteth faſhion without ſhewing iob aſtonied ſuch ſort hee hath eye hee knoweth bee true namely god well make feele ſinnes examineth onely according lawe hee conſidereth muche god pardoneth ſeruantes walke ſoundneſſe ſtraunge thing hee hauing done ſo yea euen hart neuertheleſſe handied ſo roughly feeleth heauineſſe ofhys hande better vnderſtanding heereof let v looke vpon whiche hee addeth hee deſireth god graunthym two article ſayth hide ſelfe thy ſight ſaye readie receiue puniſhment thou liſteſt complayne thy hande rough pleade wyth thee thou preſſeſt condicionally haue thoſe two poyntes one whereof ſayth hee thy hande ſhould bee withdrawne terribleneſſe ſhoulde diſmaye mee hee meeneth ſaye prayeth execute hys iudgement haue indited iob thinketh verie ſtraunge god ſhould ſcourge ſo ſore without making priuie wherefore one therefore priſoner ſhould deſire bee ſet libertie hee knoweth himſelfe quite cleane ſhaken men giue hearing vvhat ſhall priſoner tormented without examination without queſtion put vnto without proofe information layde againſt yet neuertheleſſe hee thruſt deepe dungeon ſet ſtocks iob complayneth heere ſpecially hee bee ſtreyned vpon racke ſo ſhould ſeeme hee like diſmembred ſaye poore priſoner handled ſuch faſhion woulde hee ſay iob complayneth god doth nowe execute ſuche rigour againſt yet action commenced againſte thus ye ſee firſt poynt whereof ſpeaketh theſeconde god ſhould call ſay cace might bee layde forth orderly rigour ceaſſeth men deale order lawe vvell ſayeth hee let action commenced hide thy ſight ſay refuſe thing whatſoeuer diſpoſe ſhall pleaſe thee pacient obey thee poyntes vvee ſee iob exceſsiue man oute wittes vvhy ſo hee looked well himſelfe certayne ſhould haue knowne aught hee might haue ſhewed himſelfe god muſt haue beene fayne haue come wyth head hanging downe like men come poynt muſt fayne acknowledge wretchedneſſe ſtand confoūded iob therfore would haue vſed ſuch manner talke bene forepoſſeſſed maruellous great amazedneſſe ſo moderate diſcretion humble himſelfe god became way haue good profitable leſſonto gather preſent text firſt let v remember haue ſayd alreadie wit god liſt handle v rigorous manner whiche conteyned lawe yet hath authoritie iudge world vve may well reply contrarie ſhall gaine nothing murmuring therfore haue good cauſe humble ourſelues furthermore let v conſider little cace ſhould god ſhould handle v according meaſure conuement v haue told god hath giuen v lawe reſpecting owe vnto alſo vtter perfectneſſe rightuouſneſſe hauing regarde meete conuenient creature ſtead approuing life commeth iudged lawe faine ſtand
