aſhamed yea one ſort thouſand ſinnes miſdoings bottomleſſe gulfe seeing cace ſo remaineth nothing v humble ourſelues ſighe aſhamed ſhamefulneſſe ſaid may well check god alwayes bee cauſe prouoke god wrath againſt v furthermore let v beare mynde god viſitations verie hard bee borne ſeeing iob ſo caried awaye hee wiſt hee man wittes vvhy ſo becauſe god preſſed terribleneſſe heereby wee bee warned god puniſhe v rygorouſly wee muſte needes bee ouerwhelmed diſpayre bee vtterly confounded true ſo long wee bee good way blowes ſtout ynough god commeth iuſtle v good earneſt feele force whiche wee ſet light whatſoeuer wee imagined bee ſelues ſhall bee leſſe naught nothing elſe ſmoke fonde ſurmizing requiſite knowe wee knowe nothing againſt ſaluation ſayd preſumptuouſneſſe wherewith wee bee beſotted maketh v raſh runne randon wee contented paſſe oure boundes alſo wee woulde fayne ſtye aboue cloudes ye ſee cauſe decay namely fooliſhe ouerweening wherewith dazeled moreouer ſame doth ſo hinder v calling vpon god whereas wee ought reſorte refuge broode ſelues vnder wing euerie v runneth ryot ſeeming wee moue mountaines worke wonder thus ye ſee wherein cheef point ſaluation halteth wit whereas wee ought flee vnto god prayer ſupplication ſpecially wee pinched aduerſitie laſt caſt wee goe ſeeke worldly helpes elſe wee yeelde oure owne fonde fancy haue deceyued v vvoulde wee bee exempted ſuche illuzions vayne thoughts▪ let v loke vpon ſelues example iob cōſider ſeing hath abiddē theſe ſpiritual battels ſay ſeing god preſſed ſuche wiſe hee felte enemie god doo nowe adayes ſhewe himſeife iudge wee ſhun hand eſcape rigour true wee haue ſuch conceyte wee ſhall ſo diſmayde wee ſhall ſee nothing gulfe hell gaping vpon v ſhall bee impoſsible v haue eyther reaſon modeſtie ſtay meaſure well ought wee conſider may quake yea quaking muſt ſuch terrour may continue v may come remedie wit▪ wee muſt pray vnto god graunt v grace fynde reſt middes trouble wee maye bee ſure notwithſtanding tyme hee make countenance ſet himſelfe agaynſt v deſtroy v vtterly lo howe wee haue neede pray vnto god handle v rigorouſly moreouer whē ſayth graunt theſe two thing wilcome head bolt vpright hide ſelf thee let v marke v ſummon god deſiring ſhould puniſhe v hee haue made v vnderſtand ſinnes great intruding vpon iuriſdiction shall wretched offender appoint iudge true earthly iudge may ouerrigorous man may preſſed cruelly cannot ſo god v whēſoeuer puniſheth v beareth v exceſſe neuer none true perceiue doth thing neither wee ſee ballance weight vſeth nay rather ſeemeth v turneth al thing topſie turuie yet al behoueth v honor ſecret iudgemēts let v aſſure ourſelues thing think full ſtrange neuertheleſſe ruled vprightneſſe equitie much proceede ſhall manifeſted v ende neede haue pride deſiring range god vnto fancie require ſo ſo let v content ourſelues good praying giue v pacience full obedience till haue made v perceiue doings good verely may well deſire god indite v hee puniſhe v vvherefore intent may iudges ſhall auaile v though god puniſh v euen extremitie▪ meane ſeaſon continue ſtubburne naughtineſſe wee ſo ſlouthfull dul headed thinke vpon al • would alwaies greater damnation god ſhould beate vpon v would bow backes hart would neuerawhit ſupple ſo muche would become like ſtyth beateth backe blowes god chaſtizementes ſhall neuer welfare except owne iudges condemne ourſelues firſt may know fault thoſe ſay know wretched ſinner haue well deſerued puniſhmēt ſuffer meane enter therewithall hart feele ſinnes ſuche hypocrite ſaying haue well deſerued chaſtizement without knowing wherfore true ought condemne ſinnes know yet muſt wee begin poynt namely examining conſciences ſeeking thing whiche ynough conuict v otherwiſe vnpoſsible euer man ſhould humble himſelf god condemne himſelf truly vnfaynedly ye ſee end may require god enter proceſſe againſt v puniſhe v ſay ſhew v fauor lay ſins v ende may ſee owne condemnation firſt al beaten downe ſelues lo wiſe may make requeſt reaſon aſtoniſhment iob affliction carieth v away neuertheleſſe although lawfull v yea behooffull alſo make ſuch petition vnto god wit would admitte v receiue v debate cace yet muſt require withdraw hand god well theſe thing wit make v proces therin ſhewe v hath iuſt cauſe puniſh v ſee ſinnes therewithall alſo continue make v feele ſtrokes hand god well thoſe thing togither forſomuch may match togither receiuing togither muſte bee thought ſtrāge told behalf muſt altogither like iob requireth maner admitted defence al one haue tolde already would pleade againſt god according ſayd ſhould iuſtified acquit addeth nowe ſpeake first god giue leaue ſpeake elſe anſwere whē god hath begon ſpeake iob maketh requeſt end aforeſayd wit pray god moderate rigour yet notwithſtanding make v perceyue fault hath brought v ſuch lowlineſſe become owne iudges euery one v may willingly paſſe vnder condemnation iobs intent enter cleane contrarie cace vvee ſee wherein hee fayleth ſhewed v entente wee ſhould followe meaſure haue ſpoken alreadie nowe wee ſee profite redoundeth v doctrine wee applye well oure vſe witte wee deſire bee heard god hande ſame muſt bee bring excuſes thoughe wee faultie wee could leſſen offence rather make none muſt bee enter intoo knowledge yea enter ſuch wiſe wee may bee vtterly throwne downe may bee none ſhift v flee vnto god goodneſſe wee ſhall haue condemned whole life may notwithſtanding ceaſſe truſte mercie hee hath promiſed wretched ſinners miſlike ſinnes condemne deſyring nothing god ſhould receyue mercie yee ſee wiſe wee ought practize ſayde requeſt harde v attayne ſuch reaſon therefore muſt ſtreyne ſelues hardneſſe muſte put v hearte rather prouoke v runne vntoo god praying hys grace touch v ſuche wyſe doctrine meanes hys worde wee maye offer vp ſuche requeſtes vnto wee may feele fruite faultes tolde v dayly yet thinke vpon god therefore perceyuing v ſo ſlow yea euen ſuch ſort able moue v worde lifteth vp hand ſendeth v ſome chaſtizements bicauſe affliction ſmall nothing v wee ſhake oure eare prouerbe ſayth god doubleth ſtripes ſcourgeth v holding nozes gryndſtone ſay withdrawing himſelfe v ſo hys ſpirite quenched v feele gouerneth v ſo muche become poore deſperate ſoules crie ala afterwarde become ſo inraged wee would fayne haue god giue v ſome releaſe hee giue v yee ſhall ſee v vtterly paſt ſelues ſo remedie ſtate may well deſire god withdrawe hande giue v leaue ſay ala lorde thou ſeeſt ſillie creature feele heere thy chaſtizementes ouergreat conſidering myne infirmitie true chaſtyzement due mee yea ought feele yet muche ſtrength ſo feeble weake ſeeming already ſhet vp dungeon hell ala god voutſafe thou therefore alay thy rygour little may haue leyſure take breath bethinke ſelfe better haue done vvhen haue ſuch releef come thee woundes ſhall aſſuaged ſee meane take good thy ſcourging abide vnreformable vnder thy hand behold goodneſſe god dothe vnto v ſuffereth v come vnto neuertheleſſe make ſuch requeſt vnto muſt bee done ſuch condition vvell lord true petition make neceſsity thou ſeeſt able beare thou preuent miſcheefe muſt needes fall ſuch gulfe confuzion ſhall neuer get againe neuertheleſſe lord referre ſelf wholly vnto thee thou knoweſt meet conuenient thou arte able remedie extremity wherein according thou haſte infinite meanes plucke thy ſeruant euen death adde condition god dothe well ſuffer v make ſuche requeſt yea like well lo wee haue marke ſentence waye wee muſte thinke iob ſo farre ouerſeene beare himſelfe hand hee faultleſſe hee ready enter lawe god pleade agaynſt weening ſhuld get better hād let v think iob ſotted ſuch follye vvhat vvee muſt hinke ſpake without aduiſement bee wont doe affection ouermaſter v haue eye ſo bleared diſcerne nothing example man bee beſides himſelfe greeſe anguiſh knoweth himſelf ſome light wordes eſcape hee bee told anſwere ſo yet true ſhall haue ſpoken yea ſhall ſeeme ſo owne vnderſtanding bycauſe wit troubled confounded haue ſayde paſsions carie v away ſuch wyſe bee maner beſide ſelues cace yet meane whyle god ceaſſeth maynteyne alwayes knowledge v ſhall notwithſtanding bee good choked vvhen man couereth fire wyth aſſhes earth great cole lye hyd vnderneath man ſhall ſee thing perceyue heate euen ſo doth god ſometymes ſuffer diſcretion choked v cace wee ſee nothing aſſhes ſaye paſsions vppermoſte wee ſee ſome ſteame fire ſheweth ſelfe euen ſo ſtandeth cace wyth v iob made proteſtation hee felte himſelf ſuch extremitie hee ſought meanes come god ſaying hee would firſt ſhould ſpeake let v bee ſure hee ſpake man vtterly rauing fittes seeing cace ſuche let v learne walke alwayes humilitie let v well ware affection doe carye v awaye ſuch ſorte wee knowe wee doe ſay lo heere ſentence verye profitable full good learning firſt wee ſee affection like wylde beaſtes daſhe v againſt god let v come ruſhe ſhall winne wee hard • r hee wee able make bowe elſe breake ala wee muſte needes bee cruſſhed broken peeces ruſhe againſt ſo furiouſly onely ſo alſo hee ouerthrow v blaſt nedeth breth scripture ſayeth deſtroye v vndoo v bring v nought therefore let v vnderſtand paſsions muſt bee repreſſed wee muſt hold awe yea muſt fetter ſay muſt vttermoſt abate heady frant • kneſſe elſe become ſee hath happened iob holy man mirrour pacience perſiſted mynd obey god yet notwithſtanding ſeene ſuch violence intermedled fell ruſhing ſuch wyſe wiſt much ought wee praye hartely vnto god rule paſsions ſee ſo vnruly bee able weeld repreſſe ſuch wiſe may come lift vp themſelues againſt furthermore haue hapned thē ouerſhoot ourſelues ſo haue paſſed bound hearkned vnto god let v bee diſcouraged therefore remedy pray vnto god bring v vnto reaſon agayne moreouer let v kindle againe fyre going ſay whē ſee good conſciēce falne ſleepe v manner choked ſo haue ſo muche one ſparke lyght people confounded ſaye wee perceyue let v labour come reaſon againe wee may ſay art thou thou wretched creature thou ſeeſt thou flingeſt thy ſelfe auenture yea euen againſt thy god witte thy wordes therefore ſtandeth thee hand reſtrein thy ſelf meaſuring paſsions whiche ouer vehement exceſsiue thee lo howe behooueth v come backe vnto reaſon find ourſelues ſo diſmayde wee knowe wee ſay let v aſſure ſelues thing whereby wee muſt bethinke ſelues neerely may abſteyne ſuch exceſsiue ſpeeches wee ſee iob hath vttered heere yea euen without aduiſement let v learne moderate paſsions ſuch wiſe wee may deſire nothing god giue v grace take ſuch taſte goodneſſe mercie although ſeeme ſhould confounded yet may ceaſſe reioyce reſt ourſelues vppon goodneſſe wee may glory euen middes affliction lette v caſt ſelues downe ſight good god acknowledgment ſinnes praying make v perceyue better make men foreward willing come yeeld themſelues vnto ſhall appeere iudgement ſeate may come condicion firſt owne iudges quit hys hand receyued vnto fauour infinite mercie hath ſhewed v lord ieſus chriſt whenſoeuer ſcourgeth v hee ſo aſſuage ſmart roddes may know chaſtizing v profit meanes thereof may ſtirred vp turne agayne vnto ſtrengthen ourſelues goodnes euen til come place reſt ſhal fully inioy fauour graciouſe giftes poſſeſſe hope may pleaſe grant grace v alſo people c lij sermon fourth vpon xiij chapter 23 hovv many ſi • ne iniquity haue • ſhevv miſdeede tranſgreſsion 24 vvhy doeſt thou hide thy face take thine enimie 25 doeſt thou follovv broken leafe doeſt thou perſecute drie ſtubble 26 thou vvriteſt bitterneſſe againſt makeſt poſſeſſe ſinnes youth 27 thou lockeſt feete ſtocks cannot ſcape thou printeſt ſoles feeete 28 ſhall rotte old tree garment motheaten heeretofore iob declared thing true touched yeſterday whiche god ſcourgeth v ſee reaſon wee ſhould go law euery poynte could lay ſelues could lay infinite number againſt v ſo ſhuld put confuſion meane euen rightuouſeſt men true alſo although ſeeme bee faultie law common rule yet muſt god acknowledged declared righteouſe wee ſhall reape nothing ſhame wee haue pleaded neuer ſo wel ourſelues dependeth ſtill vpon hādled yeſterday wit god hath ſecrete righteouſneſſe aboue whych knowen vnto v declared v law angel wer examined righteouſnes ſhuld condemned ther creature neuer ſo pure able ſatiſfie iob purſueth new ſayth shew miſdeedes mine iniquity much haue ſinned tranſgreſſed true heere confeſſeth forſomuch ſcourged god hande behoueth humble himſelfe howbeit hee cannot paciently indure god ſhoulde ſcourge without ſhewing reaſon thing wherein faulted god make v perceiue ſinnes wee ſee oure eye god puniſhing v bicauſe haue offended ſuch manner ſuch ſo much therein doth v great grace leaſtwiſe haue wit diſcretion condemne ſelues wee may aske forgiueneſſe hardened better knowing ſinnes notwithſtanding god holde v impriſoned wee bee beaten roddes ſo ſtripes hard v beare know hee intendeth cauſe ſcourgeth v manner yet muſt murmure caſt downe countenance ſay lorde tarrie thy leyſure till thou ſhew ende affliction true may wel wiſh would pleaſe god make v perceiue meening know might profit lawfull ynough v make ſuch requeſt yet therewithall muſt haue myldneſſe hold tung vntill pleaſe ſhew v large vnknowne v vvell may fare better ſentence let v marke iob perceyued god ſcourged marke one ſpecial point secondly fully perſwaded hee ſhould amend cace pleading againſt god furthermore alſo knew god ſcourged ordinarie manner wont puniſhmen handled iob faſhion therefore knew indured common chaſtizement ſuche one man might bring vnder ordinarie rule ſecret hidden determination god iob knew ought haue bin pacient thing haue ſpoken failed awhit great matter perceiue god hande ſtriketh v feele ſtrokes alſo know wherof proceede ye ſee thing good right profitable ſeeing know god ſhall always found righteouſe wee may well grudge againſte ſhall neuer cace muſt needes euermore condemned see yee good leſſon learne beare mind alſo ſame ſerue humble v ſo wee ſhall haue mouth ſhut end may reſtreyne bridle affection ſtomacke matter againſt god let v vnderſtand ſecrete iudgements hym wee cannot perceiue thing ſerueth alſo hold v ſo much awe may pro uoked preſumption malapertneſſe diſpute againſt god thus ye ſee good thing yet therwithall men muſt haue ſtay themſelues perceyue god puniſheth know wherefore ſay muſt quietminded tarrie till god diſcouer thing vnto whiche yet concealed poynt iob failed let v conſider forepoſſeſſed grief indured ſo greatly wondered though aſtoniſhed deſired god handle leaſtwiſe according ſinnes perſecute god bendeth himſelfe ſo againſt poore creature ſo ſtretcheth arme ſeemeth thunder vpon man hath reſpite tormented ſo hee ſeeth ende miſerie good ouerwhelmed behalfe ala maruell though ſome wandring wordes ſcape euen ſo iob vvherefore lette v learne pray god ſhall pleaſe put v ſuch incounters ſuffer v quayle▪ ſpecially infirmitie ſheweth ſelfe ſo point enter wicked imagination plucke v backe himſelfe bring v againe ſuch ſtate may glorifie incomprehenſible iudgement thus ye ſee wee haue marke firſt place vpon ſtreyne man myght demaund heere iob vſeth ſingly worde sin alone ſay shew many ſinnes haue addeth iniquity tranſgreſsions miſdeedes purpoſe doeth one hee ſhould ſaye god hath examined throughly poyntes ſhall finde cauſe handle ſo roughly iob eſteemed himſelfe rightuouſe haue ſayd already ſpeaketh troubled mind ſo hath regard thoſe thing reſteth vpon conſidering hee ſuche perſone freendes reported witte god puniſhed hym bycauſe greater ſinner men thys hath good cace meane hee conſidereth ought doo finally iob declareth god ſhall haue ſerched throughly euill ſhall find puniſhmentes indureth bicauſe miſdoings place haue made diſtinction betweene wilfull ſinne ſinne ignorance betweene committed againſt god whiche committed ouerſight terme diſtinction hath ſubſtance iob haue touched already ment rather ſet downe cace particular full better perceyuing heereof lette v marke god ſpeaketh lawe hys commaundementes hee vſeth diuerſitie termes ordinance statute decree iudgementes ſuche lyke ſeuen eyght wordes import one thing firſt formoſt hys meening ſhewe wee walke rightly wee cannot alledge ignorance vvhy ſo gyueth v full inſtruction howe wee ought lyue thoſe therefore goe aſtray make reckening obeying god vvhat reaſon wee would ſtudie hys word well could neuer doo amiſſe would guyde v poyntes caces yee ſee firſt place wherevntoo diuerſitie wordes ſerueth ſayde statute ordinance obſeruances proclamation decree teſtimonies vvitneſsings iudgements c theſe ſerue ſhewe god guideth v ſo carefully wee cannot make one falſe ſtep wee follow whych hee teacheth v therefore wee vnexcuſable amiſſe god hath ſet many barres wayes hold v backe hee hath made v certaine path hee hath ſet v boundes ſides hee hymſelfe guideth v cannot ſwarue right hand left doctrine giueth v admoniſhmentes confirming whole vſe take contrary way men may ſee purpoſed malice yea euen wit thus ye ſe men made vnexcuſable ſeeing god hath commaunded thing good word twayne hath ratified ſtabliſhed making ordinance statute obſeruances euen purpoſe men ſhoulde bee conuicted ouerheynous rebellion go againſt thoſe thing contrary part ſame manner vſed ſpeaking ſinne end men ſhoulde bee better touched vnderſtande haue committed ſmall light fault haue deſerued bee puniſhed rigour tranſgreſsions horrible example vvhen dauid twoandthirtith pſalme ſayeth man bliſſed whoſe ſinnes god forgiueth whoſe iniquity couered whoſe tranſgreſsions buried whoſe miſdoings god rememembereth see wherein mannes happineſſe conſiſteth wherefore doeth dauid ſpeake sinnes iniquity tranſgreſsions bene ynough haue ſayd one word bliſſed man whoſe ſinnes god hath forgiuen hee ment expreſſe infinite graciouſe goodneſſe god ſheweth v forgiueth v ſinnes ſhould call v reckening ala woulde bee none ende ſhould found •• e • age vnto hym ſome one parcell aſſoone hee ſhall haue caſt v one poynt ſhall new begin agayne another dauid knewe men plunged damnation deepely horribly myght bee ſauing god pulleth backe owne infinite goodneſſe hee doeth ſo men ought ouerpaſſe ſlightly hee releaſed det fiue ſhillings muſt bethinke well miſdeedes iniquity theyr tranſgreſsions muſt mynd throughly beare remembrance wee ſee vſed ſuche diuerſitie woords iob flat contrarye hee ſhould ſay true men may amiſſe many wayes true bee exceedingly blame woorthie god yet life throughly examined bee nother miſdooings tranſgreſsions iniquity deſerue god ſhoulde handle mee faſhyon wee muſt bee heedfull beare mynde hath bene ſayd namely iob ment iuſtifie himſelfe though performed thing full onely eye god intent puniſhed hym certayne wee haue ſeene already god reſpect vntoo hys ſinnes greate ment proue hys pacience lo ſcourged wee may take profit thys doctrine let v marke firſt god liſt vſe rigoure towards v certayne one ſinne may puniſh v ſuch wiſe wee ſhall knowe become yet hee ſhall v wrong much likelyhod liſted puniſh v ſinnes ſhould bee ende thirdly although puniſh v directly reſpecte faultes wee haue committed yet ſhall rightuouſe ſtill becommeth v ſinke downe vnder true lowelineſſe euen behalfe theſe three poyntes whych haue marke firſte god liſted condemne v one fault alone haue cauſe replye againſt hym ſay puniſhment ouergreat vve ſee booted cain replye againſt god wiſe ſurely hee could denye deede conuicted afore hande alreadye ſayde keeper brother life ſawe iniquitie knowen ſpited gnaſſhed teeth grunting ſayd puniſhment greater able beare behold forlorne man thou chaceſt ſhall become vvhoſoeuer meeteth mee ſhall kill mee thus ye ſee cain murmureth againſt god hys puniſhment greate ſayde ſped euer better wickedneſſe increaſed ſo much therefore let v keepe oure ſelues repinyng although wee wiſt mo one fault v v ſhewe ſinnes haue deſerued god competent iudge thereof therefore muſt puniſh v fancie ſeemeth good v according hys owne iudgement marke one poynt moreouer ſeconde poynt wee haue marke faultes innumerable ſo alſo wee muſt thinke ſtraunge god ſhould puniſh v diuers ſortes double ſtripes wee ſhould bee plunged deeper deeper intoo ſo many miſeries languiſh folke vtterly forlorne let v thinke thys geere ſtraunge faultes withoute number ſecond poynt haue beare mind third let v marke god may well vtter hand againſt v yea euen execute ſecrete iudgementes wee haue labored ſerue good conſcience imployed ourſelues faithfully vpon neighbour yea liued among men without fraude without malice without violence vvhē wee haue worſhipped ſerued god purely ſort haue walked vprightly neighbour yet god ſcourge v muſt ſtill confeſſe hym rightuouſe vve ſee yet muſt wee pleade wee muſt come ſhort ſay vvell lord thou wilt ſhewe reaſon miſerie whiche indure neuertheleſſe thinke time long howbeit lord wiſdome ynough humble ſelfe vnder thy mightie hande furthermore thou thys pleaſure time come may knowe thy purpoſe may profit howfoeuer worlde go let ceaſſe glorifye thee lo manner ought proceede iob hath deſired god enter ſorte intoo ordinarie pleading hee addeth wherefore hidest thou thy face esteemest thyne enemie following leafe already broken perfecuting ſtubble already withered heere iob alledgeth owne frailtie get ſome eaſe hys affliction ſome aſſwagement ſores hath vſed heeretofore againe heereafter thys manner praying good holy proceedeth thoſe cauſes wee ſee faythfull haue done indeede heere ye ſee haue bring vnto god would obteyne fauoure hand deliuer v miſeries ſuccoure v whiche lay feebleneſſe vvhereas fooles alledge owne woorthineſſe go binde god vnto ſay nothing wee bee wretched ſhall obteyne mercie euen ſaying ala lorde conſider thou muſt bee faine haue pitie v bycauſe thy creature vvhen man alledgeth ala nothing filthineſſe body lorde thou take away thy ſtrength beholde brought naught ſoule hath little breath thou alſo withdrawe thy breath ſay power thou haſt gyuen thencefoorth nothing furthermore ſo muche ignorance ſuch ſtore vice ſo many wantes woonder ſee ala god thou ſeeſt ſo full miſeries perceyueſt thou matter thy mercie woorke vppon vvee ſee wee bee deſirous obteyne fauoure god hande wee muſt take ſame way iob dooth heere howbeit ſo another mynde iob driuen ſtrong vehemencie bycauſe hee weerie bee ſo preſſed hande god therevpon hee fretted hymſelfe vve muſt ſo oure laying foorth oure myſeries god muſt bee ende hee may bee inclined pitie v holy ſcripture full ſuche text faithfull ſay ala lorde man behold dauid ſayth seeing life breath paſſeth away without returning lorde wilte thou haue pitie vpon v ſuccoure v ſeeing thou perceyueſt v ſo fraile god heareth ſuche requeſts appeereth text remembered fleſh breath paſſeth returneth agayne yee ſee ho 〈…〉 god witneſſeth hee ſhewed mercie child iſraell dealt according theyr deſerts bycauſe ſawe fleſh nothing corruption therefore hee bare seeing god ſuch ſpare v conſideration wretchedneſſe v certayne may ought alledge poynt vnto hym intend obteyne mercie hand therefore let v marke well word iob vſeth lawfull v ſame good forme praying vnto god ſo go humilitie ſay lord conſider leafe yea euen leafe already withered yet goeſt thou wipe ouerwhelme vtterly ſtubble already dry graſſe already cut downe life ſubſtance ala god thou perſecute moreouer ſhall become wee ſpeake maner god accept ſuche complaint come ſuche pride bound vnto v wee lay oure miſeries end ſhould ſuccoure v remedie ſuch maner prayer heard hande therewithall let v beware queſtioning iob doeth vvhy eſteemeſt thou thine enimie iob alledgeth vnſeemely thing god ſaid see lorde thou art almightie leſſe nothing yet commeſt thou holde plea againſte whereas wretched rotten tree nother life ſap vvilt thou trie thy ſtrength againſt ſayeth heeretofore ſo repeteth wordes cauſe ſayde wee muſt keepe ſelues ſo caried away oure affection although god almightie wee frayle may yet notwithſtanding nought entereth battell againſt v wee thinke ſtraunge muſt ſhut eye ſay muſt ſo ouerwiſe owne vnderſtanding ſaye would fayne knowe reaſon god handleth mee ſort let v keepe ſelues ſuche preſumptuouſneſſe yea marie meant god hath thing hande onely looke maketh mountaynes melt waxe agaynſte fire ſnow againſt ſunne word cā deſtroy whole world doth neuertheleſſe aduaunce himſelfe fight hand hand ſay wyth wretched creature vvhat meeneth vvell may argue ſort god make concluſion confound v let v ouerwiſe ſayd let v take god ſcourging v good great ſtrong ſo euer dreadfull ſo euer maieſtie bee towards v let v ceaſſe yeeld glory aſſuring ourſelues hee righteouſe hee doth allthings according reaſon though hee bend himſelfe againſte v make countenance though hee would ouerwhelme v deede good cauſe god ſhould ſhew himſelfe enimie yea euen though vnable withſtande deſpiſe v inaſmuch ſo proude wee ſtoupe vnder always ſeeme rightuouſe muſt needes ſhew v leſſon yea muſt ſhew v force good yeeld ſelues giltie therefore god compelleth v ſcourging v according deſerts thys iuſt cauſe god ſhould ſhewe himſelfe enimie againe put cace god mind ſcourge v ſinnes yet ſhew himſelfe bee enimie againſt v end wee ſhould fight againſte temptation deſirouſneſſe know ſo condemned great comberſome temptation god meening therefore ſee whither wee wyll abide firme ſtedfaſt ſeruice notwithſtanding ſeeme enimie ſeeing drift ſuch ſhould beare paciently ye ſee ought reſtreyned pleading notwithſtanding god ſhewe himſelfe enimie power abilitie v reſiſt hee hath iuſt reaſon ſo though bee priuie againe ſheweth v partly wherefore wee oughte bee contented ſmalleſt taſt hee giueth v heerewithall muſt take warning theſe two ſimilitudes namely end wee may learne walke warely alſo know great neede haue hild vp mainteyned god hand ſtrēgthened goodneſſe vvhat man god leaueth naturall ſtate doubt hee thynkes himſelfe iolly fellow ſee men ſotted ouerweening beare themſelues hand theyr owne wiſdome ſtrength haue beſides able moue mountaynes woorke wonder ſayeth ſcripture beholde broken leafe behold withered herb behold drye ſtubble ſay without freſhneſſe without ſubſtantialneſſe worſſe nothing whatſoeuer glory weene haue blaſt seeing god ſetteth ſuch mirrours afore v let v looke vppon oure owne feebleneſſe learne humble ſelues rid ſtrip ourſelues naked ouerweening men whē challenge thing themſelues deceiue themſelues wittingly willingly lo howe god commeth foorth telleth v haue v ſo beguiled fond fooliſh opinion therfore telleth v better graſſe cut downe withereth hand ſo without lyfe deſtitute ſtrength grace thus much concerning poynt iob addeth god holdeth locked vp payre ſtockes therewithall ſayeth alſo god wryteth bitterneſſe againſt hym maketh hym poſſeſſe ſinnes youth thou lockest mee ſtockes ſayeth ſayeth god ſheweth nothing ſignes wrath againſt foraſmuch ſentences oftentymes giuen writing iob hauing eye common phraſe country ſayeth god writeth bitterneſſe againſt ſay chargeth greeuouſeſt crymes could deuiſed like iudge abhorreth wretched offē der inhaunceth offence goeth ſhew ſo outrageouſe cā puniſhed rigorouſly according heerevnto iob complayneth god writeth ſo ouerrigorous ſentence againſt ynough make man heare ſtand vp ſtiffe vpon head addeth reneweth remembrance ſinnes youth purpoſe make poſſeſſe doeth making poſſeſſe import much ſay cold ſtripped clothes muſt alſo bee bound like man hys houſe abrode feeldes hee ſort ſtripped poſſeſsions euen ſo doeſt thou lord make keepe poſſeſsion ſinnes ſay cannot rid curſed vnhappie poſſeſsion ſinnes ſo wrapped cannot get heere iob acknowledgeth god hath iuſt cauſe ſcourge hym yet ceaſſeth pacience chafe therefore ſo much ought wee ſtande vpon gard ſeeing hee ſingular mirroure pacience neuertheleſſe prouoked ſuch temptation let v come knowe ſpeaketh ſinnes youth two reaſons one bycauſe age luſtes ſeene whoteſt cauſe alſo ſayd pſalme ſhall yong man order wayes euen keeping thy word vvhy ſpeaking yong folke rather others bycauſe mannes nature alwayes ſinfull wicked doeth caſt vp greateſt froath hath moſt boyling affection therefore hath neede ſtrongeſt bridle forſomuch men committe moſt faultes youth iob ſpeaketh preciſely ye ſee alſo dauid ſaith lord remember fault youth ſpeaketh expreſly age bycauſe hee knewe hee paſſed without offending god many wayes greate vnaduiſedneſſe vnruly luſt wherewith yong man blinded inſomuch thinketh nothing vnpoſsible ſtayedneſſe rule hym withall exceſſe ouerweening ſuch like thing ſo ye ſee one reaſon ſinnes youth ſpoken heere ſecond reaſon iob ment declare god brought ſinnes rememberance ſhould frame inditement faultes done euer ſince child ſo complayneth ouergreat rigoure ſhould ſaye lorde though haue erewhyles doone amiſſe well thou haſt bene ſo gracious bryng mee backe reforme thy ſeruice wherefore dooſt thou gather beadroll faultes whyche ought haue bene forgotten vvherefore commeſt thou lay agayne seeing thou haſt pardoned meete ſhould intangled new agayne yee ſee whereat iob amed heereby taught god writeth bitterly againſt v ſay ſheweth v ſignes rigour lothſome ſight wee muſt thinke wee haue gayned aught finding fault wyth wee haue well deſerued much poynt muſt alwayes come backe vntoo furthermore whome long god writeth bitterly againſt v hee vſeth accuſtomed ſweeteneſſe wont vſe towards thoſe hys whome long ſay ſheweth hymſelfe ſo ſweete ſelues god preſsing v iudgemente bycauſe hee ſeeth well wee haue neede ſuch ſo vehement remedie proofe therof eaſie matter meeken man ſo giuen pride god writeth bitterly againſt v end wee ſhould bee vtterly abaſhed yet meane ceaſſeth receyue v mercie true hyde himſelfe time hee hid hymſelfe iob according ſay heereafter wherefore hydest thou thy face let v marke god hath hid face away ſo ſeaſon ſhewe hymſelfe graciouſe pitifull towardes v yea verely perceyueth meete v true maketh delay letteth v linger payne wil helpe v conuenient ſeaſon let v marke whenſoeuer god wryteth bitterly againſt v aſſuage miſerie within according office put v graue pull v againe abide condemnation haue come god mercie redemption whyche hath purchaced v cauſe ſhet meane time haue whereof thanke god hartily ſomuch wee ſee beeyng woorthy bee condemned hys hande wee neuertheleſſe acquit see howe god allureth v dayly vvhen wee come sermon ſheweth v oure ſinnes vice hee condemneth v dayly pronounceth many ſentences againſt v inſomuch cannot open holy ſcripture ſhall find ſome condemnation euery leafe ſide cannot ſo couer vice god ſhewe v beholde thou haſt doone ſuche ſaulte beholde thou haſte committed ſuch ſinne see pray lord dealeth hath made v aſhamed ſinnes hee ſheweth v bee mercifull v lord ieſus chriſts ſake thus yee ſee ought make v magnifie hys goodneſſe furthermore although hee bryng oure olde ſinnes remembraunce agayne lette v aſſure ſelues hee doeth v wrong therein nother haue wee cauſe replye agaynſt hym wee haue ſo muche cauſe bliſſe hym wee ſee hee hath forgyuen oure olde ſinnes receyueth v ſtill mercie euer ſtate doeth god finde v come moothers womb true naughtineſſe v yet perceyued yet haue ſeede thereof incloſed v ſo curſed already bycauſe wee come curſed crabbed ſtocke god pardoneth v originall ſinne ſay ſin drayne roote mankynde hathe hee pardoned v ſinne forgiueth v ſinnes childhoode youth many mo ſinnes doeth continually pardon v afterwarde bee come fortie fiftie threeſcore yeeres age god contented forgiue v ſinne haue committed twentie yeeres ago alſo come hym ſinne committed day hee receyueth v mercifull v foraſmuch wee ſee ſo ſlowe wrath ſo foreward ſhewe mercie ala ought rauiſhed deſire glorifie mercie lo reading thys ſentence muſte warning v grunt againſt god though nowe hee bee ſomewhat bittereſt rougheſt towardes v pray hym aſſuage hys rigoure aſſuaging ſame may allure v come vnto hym finallye iob addeth whych haue ſpoken namely god holdeth hym ſtockes ſoles feete hee tearmeth rootes hys feete printed hym yee ſee hym ſayeth hee ſpeaketh hymſelfe third perſon rotten tree motheaten garment ſhall betide thou liſt purſue rotten tree motheaten garmente vve ſee yet better ſpake afore concerning troubledneſſe iob ſuch pacience yet notwithſtanding ſhaken yea ſo ſhaken fretted chafed againſt god thing ſee hee complayneth hee ſet ſtockes locked vp let v marke much leaſt may fall v haue profited ſo well god ſchoole holy man therefore may tormented ſuch ſort affliction oure impacience bewray itſelfe although wee haue true deſire hold ourſelues awe vnder hand god vvherefore let v alwayes haue poynt oure eye namely giue ſelues bridle aduance ourſelues againſt god ſeemeth paſſe meaſure ſcourging v knoweth wee bee able beare ouerlay v knoweth v able beare therefore let v droope beſeech god ſtrengthen v ſuch wiſe infirmity holy ſpirit may ouercome temptation wherewith poſsible v bee ſhaken time let v kneele downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying hym make v perceyue better wee haue doone may ſorie therewithall runne vntoo hym hee may receyue v lord ieſus chriſts ſake although wee deſerue hee ſhould ſhew himſelfe dreadfull iudge againſt v yet neuertheleſſe wyll ſhyne vpon v fatherly countenance drawe v vnto yea euen ſuche wiſe may haue acceſſe goodneſſe aſſured truſt hee pitie v meane whyle hee ſuffer v quayle affliction preſent lyfe wee may fight ſtoutly vnto end euen till hee haue taken v vp euerlaſting reſt whych hee hath prepared v heauen may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation c liij sermon first vpon fourtenth chapter man borne vvoman ſhort time filled vvith many trouble 2 commeth vp floure cut fleeth ſhadovve hath ſtay 3 thou commeſt ſet thine eye vpon ſuch one call lavv 4 vvho bring foorth cleane thing vncleanneſſe ſo much one ſaw yeſterday lawfull v alledge owne frayltie namely way petition may pleaſe god haue pitie vpon v deede perceiueth v miſerable moueth mercie ſayd wee muſt alſo beware murmure wee come vntoo god vve muſt make complaintes allegation oure owne right keepe onward ſtill end hee may haue pitie vpon v iob proceeded way heere ye ſee purpoſe holy ghoſte ſetteth downe complayntes iob made namely ſhould followe condemned hym text goodly ſayings ſuch tend good end maner altogyther good allowable heere iob ſpeaketh mannes ſtate ſuch ſelfe man ſayeth hath ſhorte tranſitorie lyfe marke one poynt ſo confirmeth ſimilitudes commeth vp floure ſayeth cut vp withereth dried vp vaniſheth away ſhadowe hath ſtay vvee ſee ſhortneſſe mannes lyfe one floure whiche incontinently withereth ſhadowe whiche paſſeth glydeth away yet ſayeth life alſo full trouble vnquietnes ſmall time liue world wee ceaſſe vexed ſtinged ſtore hartgreefs ſo haue reſt all▪ ſo miſerable ſtate itſelfe good ſooth ſee conſidering ſhortneſſe lyfe full trouble vnquietneſſe haue good cauſe pray vnto god vſe ſo great rigour towards v rather hee beare v wee oppreſſed meaſure lo lawfull v iob paſſeth wherein ſee exceſſe condemned behold ſayth oughtest thou cast thy looke thy coū tenance vpon poore creature ſo tranſitorie hath nothing miſerie wherefore doeſt thou bende thy ſelfe way catch trip fit match thee vvee ſee iob vnder pretence hys infirmitie would haue ſhifted god ſhould haue plaged fully reſolued concluded vpon poynt ſheweth v affection torment v ought reſiſt alſo reſiſted well howbeit meane whyle ceaſſeth bewray toſſed many euill thought euery one v findeth experience himſelfe conſequently hee addeth yet one ſentence therevpon man myght reply god afflicteth men without cauſe forſomuchas bee ſinners ſayeth wee come corrupt euill lump ſhould wee pure cleane maruell wee bee full ſoyle ſpring iſſue heere iob ſpeake ſhould ſeeme men ought excuſed bicauſe ſin nature ſo little ought eaſe euill ſo much faultie aſſoone enter worlde wee already enimies god nothing rebellion naughtineſſe v nothyng ſeede ſin come wee age miſcheefe increaced augmented ſo much one drop goodneſſe v let v conclude whereas men ſay excuſe borne full filthineſſe ought ſo muche rather curſed reiected god thus ſee heere yet one faultie affection iob whiche reported v holy ghoſt end may learne profit ſelues wee haue conſidered oure nature foraſmuch effect wee haue iobs meening let v marke inſtruction conteyned ſentence ſayth man ſhort lyfe yet meane whyle filled many trouble heereby inſtructed firſt ſet mind much vppon world ſeeing nothing paſſe away thys common thing yet conceyue ſo well requiſite proofe heereof although wee haue three dayes liue heere yet vntangled affection care preſent life tickle tranſitorie man neuer thinke hymſelfe haue goodes ynough hee deſirous come honour deuiſeth practizeth ſides bee ſhort man bottomleſſe pit vnſatiable gulfe inſomuch cannot bee ſatiſfied goodes earth nother end meaſure hym cauſe thereof surely conſidered ſhortneſſe life luſts woulde alayed deſires wold ſo headſtrong could conſider lyfe nothing howbeit meane ſo ſharp ſet vpon gathering rich thinke vppon nothing elſe cauſe thereof mind always beneath ſo ſee confeſsion euery v maketh wit life ſhadow paſſeth away hand hypocriſie leaſing truth ſo haue printed hart fully reſolued ſuperfluouſe thing ſcripture telleth vsſo often life nothing vaniſheth away hande let v aſſure ourſelues good cauſe put v minde rememberance foraſmuch wee forget neuer tarieth awhit hart thus yee ſee wee haue conſider firſt place ynough know ſhortneſſe life muſt go yet greefe v knowe nothing elſe fade away worlde oure tyme glideth away hope endleſſe lyfe otherwiſe ſhould bee myſerable vnhappie brute beaſtes therefore wee muſt make compariſon wyth heauenly lyfe wherevnto god calleth v euery day ſo ſhuld deſpize baſe corruptible thing worlde ſo much tyed agayne wee would aduaunce ſelues aloft take contentation reſt ſecondly might well alledge ſame god oft deſire haue pitie vppon v miſeries thing perſwade ſuccour v prouide neceſsities thus much concerning infirmitie ſhortneſſe mannes lyfe trouble alſo ſet downe vnder woorde iob hathe comprehended paſsions wherewith turmoyled inordinate luſts liking tormenter man cannot haue worſe tormenter hymſelf puniſhing himſelfe owne inordinate paſsions man bee gyuen vayneglory beholde ſuche fire kindled hym hee ſhall thinke wyth hymſelfe hee neuer come ſoone ynough credite eſtimation inſomuch ſome man happen honoure hym ye ſhall ſee hym nettled ſome hinder hys aduauncement ſtreitwayes enuieth hym bee ſhort needeth one luſt ingender v thouſande others wee ſhall haue matched theſe two thinges togither ſhall wee haue ſo much cauſe miſlike preſente life true haue ſayde afore ſaying ſtraunge world v conuicted experience yet euery one v ought ſet minde throughly vpon without cauſe ſcripture ſpeaketh thereof ſaying although man come fourſcore yeeres vpward wee muſt eſteeme ſame bee long time let v conſider childhoode vve lyue good worlde wee bee entered life indeede chilhood wee nother witte reaſon verely although yong folke haue diſcretion diſcerne good euill yet doo ſo ouerflow theyr bankes runne royot ſettled conſtancie thus yee fee one part age paſſeth ſlippeth away wee haue begonne liue bycauſe wee knowe good footh man knoweth wherefore god created hath skill perceyue end ſet world pray ſpeake properly ought ſayd lyueth hath confuzed knowledge wee come middle age vvee ſee care increace man haue regarde hee thinketh haue hithertoo beene rouer haue beene wanton fond anye man may nowe recouer time haue loſt bee verye harde afterwarde man haue charge child hee thinketh go ſhift mee take order ſtate yet ſhall neuer ſo ſoone come time ſhall bee taken away incontinent thus yee ſee vnquietneſſe beginneth martir men man come fiftie yeeres old may ſayde deathe ſeene ſummon dayly although diſeaſes aſſayle v yet well ſeene draw neere ende man come foureſcore yeeres ſeene graue hande ſo manner hee alyue wyll greeue man ſee himſelfe vnmeete world hee ſeeth hee burthen brings many trouble comberſome others hee comberſome hymſelfe therefore nought told v haue earſt ſayde wee ſet one yeere worlde wee ought doo hundred agayne wee conſider howe oure lyfe miſguided put true vſe muche ſtandeth v hande bethinke v well ſuche ſayings warning witte man borne woman ſhorte flightfull lyfe better conceyuing ſhortneſſe muſt alſo match trouble put cace life farre longer cauſe haue like ſo well ſeeing ſo vexed vvhy rather come ſeeking reſt prepared v heauen heerewithall haue marke whence theſe trouble come vpon v witte owne naughtie affection wee troubled folk meane reſt ourſelues yea verely true reſt might well complayne diſquietneſſe preſent life free courſe went owne pace foraſmuch euery man hangman himſelfe haue ſayd already owne luſts paſsions deſires cauſe vnquietneſſe incomberance whome againſt whome ſhall make oure complaint let v learne haue conſidered well muſt blame god commence action againſt find fault ourſelues finall poynt whervnto muſt come know ſhortneſſe life bee abaſhed wee thinke thereof yet better expreſſed foloweth ſayth pure thing cleane commeth vncleanneſſe filthineſſe ſaying bee admoniſhed miſeries indure proceede coruption man nature better comprehending doctrine let v note ſpeaking mā whiche queſtion concerneth god worke creation adam created another manner one day vve falne ſtate wherein god ſet adam mankinde adam perſone adam created image god endewed excellent giftes grace yea vnſubiect death importeth image god perfectneſſe rightuouſneſſe ſoundneſſe wherethrough god vttered great rich ſo effect mā mirrour excellent glory ſhyneth fully god ſin bereft gift grace baniſhed kingdome god bycauſe hath forſaken v alſo deſtitute life whereof fountayne welſpring wherein lyeth fulneſſe al good thing god muſt needes conclude cut wee bee left miſerie yea euen death ſay proceedeth creation wee deſtitute benefite god giuen v hencefoorth haue bereft ſin man mighte moue queſtion ſeemeth iobs meening cauſe vnbeleefe ſinnes vice v bycauſe wee come deſcend adam race come adam concerning body vvhere doth ſinne dwell hath proper ſeate soule ſhew reaſon mean ſoules alſo ſhould come race line adam therefore ſeemeth iob reaſoneth aright haue marke like god created mankind owne image perſon adam euē ſo alſo adam ſin adam himſelfe conſequently alſo ofſpring depriued ſhet grace bin beſtowed vpon whereof commeth bycauſe wee incloſed within perſone according god vvee muſt heere diſpute naturall reaſon knowe whether ſo behoueth v know god giue firſt father would haue v tooke ſame alſo ſame ruine confuzion let v haue eye ordinance god let v ſettle ourſelues therevpon let v beleeue wit imagination thus yee ſee ſhortly haue beare away true matter might bee dilated large ynough v vnderſtande cheefe poynt two three word mind thing conteyned namely maruell though men full vncleanneſſe nothing filthineſſe taken corrupt lump therefore ſo much one otherwiſe true although ieſus chriſt man yet exempted vncleanneſſe bycauſe conceuyed holy ghoſt god ordeyned peculiarly oure lord ieſus chriſte ſhould bee conceyued power aboue end adam vncleanneſſe might light hym hee bee defiled therewith wee conceiued foraſmuch common order man nature ſubiect ſaid corruption poſſible find one mortall wight full vnrighteouſneſſe ſauing lord ieſus chriſt let v marke whence come wee haue call rememberance hath bin touched witte wiſe wee ought alledge vntoo god ſhortneſſe life miſeries wherevnto ſame ſubiecte end ſhuld haue pitie vpon v murmure againſt howbeit therewithall muſt alſo miſlike owne life haue touched already namely wiſt well life flightfull bethought v miſeries wherewyth fraughted peſtered wold ſo farre loue wee bee heere ye ſee good cauſe ought ſo much waker neuertheleſſe behoueth v keepe meaſure thys behalfe haue bin many heathen whyche haue knowen thing rightly ſpoken heere haue bin ſo fully perſwaded haue bin weery loth liue world yea ſee haue fordone themſelues ſawe well miſeries heere wee muſt come ſuch extremitie vvhat vvhen wee conſider life vaniſheth away moment let v conſider alſo whence ſame ſwiftneſſe proceedeth witte ſinne created end death ſhould haue dominion ouer v come vppon v father adam ſomuch v giltie ſinne therefore talke ſhortneſſe life wee muſt enter acknowledgement originall ſinne againe whence come miſeries hedge v round bycauſe wee baniſhed god kingdome welfare lieth wee miſerable ſo long ſeparated god ſeparated reaſon ſinnes therefore ſtandeth v hande returne always thither vvhen haue learned blame ſelues ſort ſhal deale thoſe murmure againſt god howe ſay ſeene men cheefe woorke god among creature ſhewe muche excellencie dignitie al reſt yet vexed troubled beyōd meaſure • meaneth verely many heatheniſh folke haue herevpō taken occaſion murmure againſt god ſhould ſay ſet man vpon ſcaffold make mockerie gazingſtocke notwithſtanding hee ſeeme nobleſt creature ſhal haue cōſidered miſeries wherto ſubiect proceede owne faultineſſe bicauſe wee ſinfull ſhall haue mouthes ſtopped ſo ſhall preſume murmure againſt god marke one poynte yet ynough vnleſſe wee haue eye remedie god hath giuen v doubt ſhall caried away ſuch deſperation cannot blaſpheme god deede certaine thoſe fordoo thēſelues deſpite god although knowen thēſelues blameworthy owne miſeries yet booted aſſwagement theyr ſorrow heauineſſe therfore fall deſpaire let v haue eye able aſſwage anguiſh example firſt although life miſerable yet neuertheleſſe god maketh v taſte goodneſſe ſo many wayes wee may well conclude rightly happy bicauſe maketh v parttakers benefites life ſhort howbeit ſo ſhort god gyueth v reſpite ynough knowe bee father ſauioure taſte power v calleth v vnto ſhold haue benefite paſte quarter houre inioy longer time pray ought make account ſuche benefite agayne although wee ſuffer heate colde hunger thirſt bee diuerſe wayes perſecuted beſydes inconueniences happen men handes wee haue gulfe within v deede wee haue ſtore temptation come vpon v whiche verely manye incomberances yet notwithſtanding god giueth v ſome taſt mercie ſee hee holdeth v vp pleaſeth chaſtiſe v either giueth v pacience elſe ſo meaſureth rigoure alwaies feele goodneſſe seing euen trouble vnquietneſſe worlde wee haue ſome occaſion comforte cheere vp ſelues god recompence ought ſuffize v nowe complayne god hath ſet v worlde haue wee cauſe rather bliſſe glorifie lette v marke well ſtandeth v hande beware fall ſuch extremitie ſay vvo worth man better neuer bin borne ſo turmoyled worlde haue foreſayde conſideration may ſure ſhall come confuſion vvhat bee done vve muſte ioyne poynts togither ſay ala preſent life bee ſooner entred wee giue vp ghoſte wee tarry heere ſee nothing eye miſerie graue hemmeth v ſides alſo better v die ſome one kinde death hande bee ſo aſſaulted thouſande thouſands afterward wee haue ouerpaſſed ſo many incomberances effect wee doo pine away peecemeale therefore wee bethinke v well oure ſtate ſhall haue good cauſe miſlike worlde bycauſe inconueniences whiche wee indure proceede owne ſinnes though yet doth god meane make v feele goodneſſe haue v ſo diſmaide ouerſorrowed ſhould haue whereof reioyce furthermore foraſmuche ſheweth v wee wayfarer worlde miſeries ſhall continue euer ſhortneſſe lyfe ought greeue v rather comfort v howe thoſe ſo fantaſticall ſay tuſhe man life gone turning hande reſt vpon poynte fall hartburning ſay muſte wee liue ſo ſmall doth god play mockholyday v ſay returne agayne mee hand coulde giue v longer lyfe leaſtwiſe make v knowe remedie oure life haue one day good tyme life hangeth threed death alwayes betweene teeth behold ſay poynt whiche altogither ſettle reſte themſelues vpon ſhortneſſe mās life let v thinke thus ſelues vvell god meeneth wee ſhoulde linger heere foreuer true wee bee ſubiect many miſeries ſo much knoweth owne ſtate oughte ſigh grone continually ſo long world god hath appointed ende calleth v himſelfe good ſure reſte cace ſtandeth therevpon hauing lyfe equall life length tyme god maketh v partaker owne life endleſſe therefore let v good cheere ſeeing wee haue whereof reioyce ſhortneſſe oure life cauſe bee pacient cauſe bee muche quiet hope heauenly life ſhould perceiue world nothing wee diſquieted vvell may wee ſigh matter ſhall comforted bicauſe wee bee ſure god bring v good end receyuing v intoo euerlaſting reſte thus yee ſee wiſe wee ought marke doctrine purpoſe fare better furthermore ſoraſmuch wee ſee men ſo turmoyled vnquietneſſe tormenting themſelues owne affection luſts haue ſo muche cauſe bridle fleſhly affection v coueteth liue peace vvee well confeſſe although haue world wil yet notwithſtanding wee bee vnquieted oure ſelues behold ſo greate corzie reſte nothing woorth cā confeſſe wherin lyeth peace hauing eye vpon god reſting ſuche wi • e vpon loue hee beareth v namely vpon free loue acknowledge ſelues alwayes vnhappie till hee receyue v himſelfe moreouer traueling towardes kingdome withoute ſetting hart vpon theſe corruptible thing lo peace men cōſiſteth ſteade hereof ſeemeth make warre god ende ſhould riſe vp againſte v make v feele enemie wee haue faine ſet vpon v therefore let euery v beware bridle paſsions affectiōs come like wilde beaſtes lift vp ſelues againſt god muſte worſe ſtarke mad let v beare well mind ſayde cōcerning troubleſomneſſe mās life let v ſo thinke vpō may ſerue rule correct oure wicked luſtes ſtirre v thruſt v forward vnto euill ye ſee wiſe wee ought practize leſſon receiue good auailable inſtruction ſaluation specal • vpon poynt ſayd man make thing pure cleane commeth vncleanneſſe filthineſſe let v marke well lord ment ſend v confuſion intent ſhould haue aught wherof boaſt onely meere goodneſſe requiſite men ſhould ſhamed ſort bicauſe blindfold owne eye beare themſelues hand much worthineſſe vvee ſee diuell neuer ceaſſed yet deface cōteined holy ſcripture cōcerning corruption mā haue bin heretiks inough haue borne world hand originall ſinne nothing except follow adam owne yet god ſhoulde altogither preuaile neuertheleſſe papacie ther forging free buylding morall vertues reaſon whereof ſet downe afore ende tendeth men ſhould like well themſelues thinke themſelues haue ſome goodneſſe body dareth ſaye man able ſaue himſelfe euen papacie confeſſed wee haue neede god grace onely forgyuing oure ſinnes alſo aiding v holy ſpirite yet ſaye commeth papiſtes confeſſe ſay haue certayne portion goodneſſe oure ſelues god neede helpe v reſte lo howe god made cohelper ſay muſt help infirmitie yet muſte wee ſide companion deuill hath ſo bewitched men hee maketh beleeue bee wote yet wee ſee alſo worldwarde men ſtande greatly owne conceit commeth paſſe ſuche haue witte knowledge ſo aduance themſelues credite authoritie idol honoure themſelues ſhort needeth nothing perſwade men greate worthineſſe althoughe man tell yet dooth euery man forge frame ſtore leazings beguyle himſelfe withall flatterings put v beſides wee receyue eaſily may ſuger v god therfore fayne knocke v harde vpon head greate beetels beate v downe ſhoulde let v alone wee bee pryde woulde dwell continually v would bow downe necke nother wold bee acknowne dette ſay cauſe holy ghoſt ſpeaketh v vncleanneſſe whiche v nature dauid one fifteth pſalme ſayeth hee begotten ſinne mother conceyued ſinne hee accuſeth nother father mother pleadeth gyltie himſelfe ſayd vncleane god euen byrth howbeit ſee iob ſo carryed awaye former paſsions hee applyed thing cleane cōtrarie vvherfore ſayeth thing commeth vncleanneſſe cannot pure cleane intent ſeeke ſome ſtartinghole abate damnation lyeth vpon men cleane cōtrariwiſe ſee text alledged dauid dauid acknowledged horrible ſinne whereby offended god hilde himſelfe cōtented paſſed ſaying ala lorde onely life time haue done amiſſe haue alſo brought ſuche poſſeſsion ſinne byrth euer ſince borne world haue ſtill increaſed euil wherof haue ſeede within thus ye ſee dauid ſet originall ſinne hys eye hunt pretence cleere himſelf god paſſe cōdemnation wherin muſt ſo deale ſpeake originall ſinne may bee exempt ſelues god iudgemente wee ſee theſe skoffers doo whiche ſay ſeeing man ordeyned ſinne ſeeyng hee miſframed nature ſeeyng nothing ignorance ſeeing hee altogither rebellious agaynſte god poore creature doo meete god ſhoulde vpon condemne v certeſſe although wee bee ſo wretched yet ſhifte v rather ſerueth inhaunce oure euill vvhen sainct paule ſayeth naturally child wrath oneth hee cleere men myghte haue good cace godward ſinnes might bee layde charge bicauſe wee haue roote oure owne nature sainct paule meeneth ſuch thing ſayth end fleſhe ſhoulde bee confounded mouthes ſtopped god yee ſee poynte muſte come oft ſpeake originall ſinne namely muſte day day enter examination ſelues knowe wee haue offended god ſo many wayes wee haue deſerued dye therevpon ſay ala wee haue gathered togither ſaultes know yet infinite ſort beſide impoſsible men ſhoulde call minde hundreth parte offence haue committed againſte god yet beſides borne ſinne yea ſoked behold ſinners god haue diſcretion vvhē think v ſhall haue cauſe hūble ſelues yeelde glory vnto god vvhē iob ſaith hee make pure cleane thing come vncleanneſſe thereby ſheweth mē ſtarke mad whē beare themſelues hād pure cleane thē let v beare mind reſpect oure ſelues remaineth nothing v cōfuſion decay bicauſe bee ſo ouerloden ſinne vice god might rightly caſt v away yet neuertheleſſe forſomuch hee chalengeth himſelfe office waſhing clenſing v ſpottes muſt reſort refuge ſpecially bycauſe hath giuen v lord ieſus chriſt hath al cleanneſſe god ſeeing v de filed ſtayned way ouerlōg high v come hath voutſafed giue v ſuche holines ieſus chriſt waſh ſelues bloud wee ſhall become pure cleane oure filthineſſe vvhen know lump come nothing vncleanneſſe bothe oure bodyes oure mind let v pray lorde ieſus chriſt voutſafe rince v bloud ſheade thoſe cleere water vpon v wherof ezechiel ſpeaketh wit holy ghoſt giuen vnto fulneſſe may waſhed frō day day ende may come pureneſſe hee hath promiſed v haue need double clēſing one god ſhould forgiue fault waſhing away ſpottes ſhould renew v holy ſpirite clenze v frō wicked affection luſts hath done ſo one day muſte faine cōtinue life long vntill haue brought v perfection long ſhew v hoping hath bin nought ſhall bee diſappoynted oure longing conditionally haue wayted requireth let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgemē ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may know great neede haue flee mercy whē ſhal haue made v feele goodneſſe middes affliction may deſire liue world ſaue glorify name ſo let v ſay almighty god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe according truth worthy lift vp eye heauen preſent ſelues thee preſume ſo farre prayer ſhould c liiij sermon ſecond vpon xiiij chapter 5 dayes limited number moneths thee haſt thou made ordinance vvhich hee ſhall paſſe 6 turne thee avvaye lette bee reſte tyll deſired day come daye hireling 7 hope tree cut dovvne ſhall ſpring agayne impes vvill grovve vp agayne 8 although roote bee vvaxed olde body bee ſeared deade 9 yet vvill hee ſpring agayne force vvater vvill hee ſpred foorth plant 10 man fayle ſo hee dye commeth 11 like vvaters ſhoulde ſhrinke sea riuer ſhould paſſe avvay 12 euen ſo men riſe agayne till heauen thinke nother doe riſe agayne ſleepe yeſterday wee ſawe requeſt iob made reaſon fickleneſſe man life ſum whereof aſmuch man ſo fraile flightfull creature ſeemeth reaſonable god ſhould purſue ſuch rigour vtter force ſo againſt haue ſeene afore declareth life ſo ſhort much miſerable men cōtinual torment addeth god hath life man hande hath limited tearme whiche cannot bee paſſed man lyued fewe dayes god hath ordeined yet might mā ſay well god diſpleaſed therfore cannot abyde little tyme ſhoulde paſſe withoute puniſhing haue doone amiſſe ſeeyng hee hath foreordeyned wee ſhoulde liue pleaſure determination ſeeing hath poynted laſte inſtante life haue v come ſame ſeeyng ſo ſaith iob cannot indure man ſhould finiſhe courſe come dayes ende dooth hireling doth hee handle gently ſeeyng wee bee ſo troubled vnquietneſſe preſente lyfe may well ſayde like labourer hyred daye looke vppon labouring man ſee hee toyles himſelfe earne peece money dayes woorke ende hee taketh reſte hee hath wage euen ſo v oure lyfe long bycauſe ſubiecte ſo manye miſeries wee hope paſte wee ſhall bee quyte diſcharged deathe bee come wee made ende oure taske haue cauſe gladde bycauſe wee come reſte thus yee ſee iobs meaning heerewithall wee muſte alſo beare continually minde hath bene ſayde namely heere hee declareth owne paſsions muſte allowe ſo muche god condemneth wherefore wrytten firſte ende myght ſee euē perfecteſt ſort although bee neuer ſo pacient fayle haue greate hardineſſe fyghting agaynſte paſsions theyr fleſhe god layeth hande vpon vve muſt thinke iob ſuche lyke made ſteele ſenſleſſe folke althoughe ſingular ſtouteneſſe indeuored themſelues obey god yet withoute touche breſte fayne feeele maruaylous ſtings theyr fleſhe althoughe outſtoode temptation gat vpper hande yet ſtormes toſſed fro meane ſeaſon tolde v end ſhould ſtand vpon garde pray god ſtrengthen v aſſuring ſelues although wee neuer ſo good deſire honoure yet ſhould wee vanquiſhed holdeth v vp hand giueth v ſtrength aboue fight valiantly ſtedfaſtneſſe beſides admoniſhed alſo hart though wee ſeeme poynt quayle bee diſcouraged excellenteſt men euer haue alwayes bin ſo effeebled tyme howbeit god hath ſtood ſuch wiſe haue gotten vpper hande battelles god giue ſuche victorie alſo call vpon bee ſo fooliſhe ſooth ſelues owne vice finally let v cōſider vſe wee ought applie whiche ſayde heere namely god hath bounded tyme man lyfe well ende wee might ſay hee ought leaue v found v ſhould get away v iob ſayde yeſterday ſeemed vnreaſonable god ſhoulde open eye vpon ſo wretched creature hee ought let men alone bycauſe bee worthy bee matched ſtrength lette v marke fayre hande ſhoulde make god ſhoulde get away v meane ſhoulde guyde v redreſſe v wee amiſſe wee liue one daye without god viſitation fall aſleepe ſinnes much hee ſpare v long time according wee ſee men proſperitie know god iudge ouer cannot find hart hild vnder yoke bridled man cannot meanes bring reaſon seeing ſo rebellious wold god ſhould let v alone time life woulde play horſes broken looce wold way make v knowe ſelues wee might returne vnto god therefore behoueth v pray pitie v ſo tame luſtes fleſh may bee teachable obedient towardes let v marke well exceſsiue paſsion iob alledge meete conuenient god let men alone bicauſe life ſhorte brittle bicauſe hee himſelfe hathe aſsigned determinate terme agayne verie requiſite god ſhould watch ouer v looke narrowly v bycauſe lyeth v guyde oure owne ſteppes wee protection pray wold become v pitifull ſee many deathes wee beſeeged god neede haue fatherly care oure life whereas iob deſireth god withdrawe himſelfe let v pray draw neerer v two ſortes firſt inaſmuch behoofe cuſtodie mainteyned bicauſe liue ſuſteyned power may pleaſe make v feele preſence know newre hande v aide v ſuccoure v furthermore whiche ſecond point may alſo pleaſe bee neere hande v chaſtize v hee ſeeth v farre ſquare true wee ought pray vſe ſuch gentleneſſe towardes v may preſſed bee able beare yet therewithall haue alſo deſire lifte vp hande hee ſeeth wee haue neede correction hee ſhoulde let v alone ynough rocke v aſleepe make v block thus much concerning poynt aboue ought wey well ſayde heere namely life man determined god bee hath account oure monethes handes hath ſette ordinance whiche cannot bee paſſed heerevpon wee haue cauſe take greate comforte life god hande beholde heere cauſe men ſo fearefull dare ſtirre one finger trembling ſeemeth thing thing may befall namely knowe god hath keeping belongeth well take world hath created wee throughly perſwaded certaine ſhould go pace ſo tormented much ought wee make accounte doctrine conteyned heere witte god hath limited dayes howbeit true muſt keepe meane behalfe although wee ought warrant oure ſelues ſeeing life god hande yet muſt wee raſh caſt ſelues geeriſhly daunger wee muſte walke aduiſedly according god commaundeth v ſome fantaſticall perſones hearing dayes man numbered wee nother lengthen ſhorten lyfe bycauſe god hand good pleaſure ſay well come heade one borne hanged ſhall neuer drowned prouerb ſayes among papiſts yea vnthrifts among v diſpoſed dally god vſe ſame woulde god ſo common deede common men know well ynough whome ſpeake thē ye ſee theſe deſpiſers god take occaſion ſay wee may ſhut oure eye paſſe throughe fire water bycauſe god hath limited dayes yea intent ſcripture ſpeaketh ſo ſaieth god hauing put v world knoweth long ought holde v bee hande behooueth v departe hence whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe according alſo ſayde nintenth pſalme wherfore told v intent ſhold learne put ſelues god hand ſay vvell lord ſeeing ſo thou diſpoſeſt v thy good pleaſure giue v grace lyue dye according thy good may couet liue longer ſhall pleaſe thee alſo oure lyfe may ſeeme ouerlong v thou liſteſt hold v heere meane time may ſerue thee ſpending time well whiche thou haſt giuen v rather ſo ſhort agayne heerevpon lorde ſeeing thou holdeſt life thy hande yet haue v knowe terme haſte reſerued thyne owne knowledge graūt v grace walke feare warely thou haſte giuen v meanes mainteyne preſent life thou haſt gyuen v meate drinke gyue v grace vſe ſoberly temperance moreouer thou haſte gyuen v remedyes wee bee diſeaſed thou wylte haue v wante thing therefore gyue v grace wee maye deſire tarrie flightfull lyfe onely ſerue honoure thee lorde let v walke poyntes thou commaundeſt v according whiche ſayde one nintyeth pſalme god wyll ſende angelles garde v wee may ſtumble make falſe ſteppe wee walke wayes ſay wee may playe ſtray coltes skurrie heere theſe vnthriftes wyll meanes ſubmitte themſelues vnto god therefore whenſoeuer wee abyde waye hee ſheweth v wee garded angel doone wee muſte alſo conceyue good holie hardyneſſe god wyll haue v enter intoo anye daunger howe vvee ſee daye ſtate poore chriſtians witte bee ſheepe wolues mouthes nowe ſhould go aboute excuſe oure ſelues ſeruing god forbeare confeſſe oure fayth bycauſe cannot bee doone withoute ieopardie oure lyfe ſuppoſe yee god accept ſo fonde excuſe hath life hande let v truſt hee keepe v hee good faithfull pleaſe wee ſhall continue ſhall bee withoute hee giue v ſtrength power thus yee ſee muſt applye vſe ſpoken heere otherwiſe betide v wee ſee hath done many others ſhrinke away gyue ouer ſeruice god bycauſe ſhunne croſſe vnbeleefe grounde thereof bycauſe knowe leaſtwiſe throughlye perſwaded god hath appoynted tearme cannot prolong wee fully reſolued poynt certayne wee ſhoulde bee bolder ſpende ſelues ſtandeth vppon honouring god performance oure dutie according becommeth euerye man degree ſay ſhould haue another manner conſtancie ſtoutneſſe wee haue true muſt make v raſh ſuch wiſe ſhould go ſeeke daungers owne heades withoute aduice whenſoeuer neede ſhall require wee ſhall ſticke go vnto death forſomuch know men whatſoeuer attēpt practize againſt v able nothing ſeeing doctrine greatly profite lette v determine beare well minde therevpon conclude according alſo oure lorde ieſus chriſt telleth v heares head numbered god holdeth v ſuche wiſe cuſtodie wee neede feare thing happen vnto v without good pleaſure true satan aſſayeth meanes hee ſide wee ſee men make full reckning turne vpſide downe ſhould ſeeme woulde confounde heauen earth togither yea haue done theyr vttermoſt able take away lyfe except god gyue leaue bee willing therewith howe withſtand let v looke god commaundeth v let v looke calling dutie beareth doo let euery man imploy himſelfe faythfully aſſuring ſelues ſhall finiſh courſe yea euen bycauſe hande god thus ye ſee haue marke vpon ſentence iob hath ſayde ſo hee addeth hope tree tree cut may ſpring agayne ſpecially hee haue nouriſhmēt water hee may foriſhe freſhe like hope man dead past recouery ſaieth therefore god ought haue pitie ſo po • creature heere firſte bluſhe may ſeeme ſtraunge iob cutteth hope man hee deade ſeemeth heere remembrance euerlaſting life thoughe men ſoules dyed body let v note firſte iob ſpeaketh men hee ſpeaketh paſsions torment haue ſeene already therfore hath reſpect preſent life according bee preſſed miſerie minde runnes vpon nothing bee ſummertime ouerwhot thinke hard froſt pleaſanteſt holſomeſt thing could bee bycauſe forepoſſeſſed paſsion greeueth tormenteth v foraſmuch god hand ſo ſore vpon iob none regard get preſente peynes hope lyfe come hee minded heere ſeene men troubled ſort aduerſitie god doe releeue ſtrengthen true iob cānot charged haue cōcluded god doth vtterly roote men whē taketh world iob ſay made ſuch finall cō cluſion yet muſte note ſo dazeled paſsions thē remembred man continueth ſtill god death hath ſecret life ſame life hath good ſeede ſo ſhall fully reſtored perfectiō farre nowe witte heauenly glory glorious immortalitie iob thē rememberance ſettle himſelfe therevpon dazeled paſsions time therefore wee muſte looke ſelues warer ſaide afore euen ſo reſt theſe wordes certainly iob knew well god doth men ſingular good turne viſiteth man asked great honor god doth v wheras ſtinking carkaſſes yet voutſafeth caſte eye vpon v chaſtize v haue done amiſſe father doth child wolde haue anſwered yes yet able conceyue firſt brunt hee might haue reſiſted owne paſsions fayne bee tormented indure greate diſtreſſe muche ought wee receyue aduertyzemente ala lord lyfe ſhort brittle nothing filthineſſe corruption v yet thou forgetteſt v deſerue wee thou ſhouldeſt regarde v wee worthy thou ſhouldeſt viſit v ala lorde angelles heauen woorthie ſhoulde bee worthie rottenneſſe ſtinche thou thyne infinite goodneſſe arte willing friendly familiar v thou beholdeſt v pitie wee haue doone amiſſe ſteade tying v therevnto thou ſtill pulleſt v backe thee aſ • aieſt meanes bring v repentance lorde goodneſſe lo howe wee ought ſpeake ſame alſo bee ſayde preſente ſentence wee maye fare better ſithe men haue ſtrength themſelues ſpring ſhoote forth braunches newe agayne tree doo whiche haue ſome roote earth doo rotte away quite cleane let v acknowledge good god doeth v pleaſeth preſerue oure life common order nature alſo keepeth hydden alofte bee manifeſted agayne tyme conuenient therefore lette v acknowledge ſame bee ineſtimable priuiledge better vnderſtanding leſſon lette v marke firſte although men bee immortall yet haue theyr owne ſtrength withoute cauſe sainct paule yeeldeth title immortalitie euerlaſtingneſſe peculiarlie vnto god ſhall wee ſaye angelles vvhat ſhall wee ſaye men mortall brute beaſtes certaine feele well god breatheth power oure ſoules yee ſee wee haue ſpirituall life elſe borrowe although ſoules come nought ne rotte away body yet notwithſtāding alienated god farre horrible death vtterly returned nothing ſtate better vtterly foredone beeſeparated god feele bee againſt v muſte god faine giue v another life hee knit v himſelfe grace holy spirite ſo hee may lyue reigne v haue chiefe benefite wherein wee ioy meane god worketh ſtraunge faſhion vnknowen mannes reaſon let v conſider ſtate faithfull life world ſet like ſtate vnbeleuers made muche poore miſerable man looke vpon child god ſhall finde bee afflicted ſo ſeemeth ought bee cut mankind though worthy lyue vppon earthe thus ye ſee ſort god ſuffreth dealte withall vvhat done let v come backe sainct paule ſaith coloſsians witte deade life lyeth hid lorde ieſus chriſte god ſhewe due time ſee goodly ſimilitude iob ſetteth downe ſaieth tree fade cō ming winter appeereth greeneneſſe ſeemeth dead leaues falne tree themſelues froſtebitten yet life ceaſſeth lye hid rootes heart vvee ſee ſpring time come ſhootes foorth againe liuelines vnſeene time ſheweth ſelfe anewe nowe god ſhew v tree vtter greater operation towards v ſo excellent creature soothly sainct paule ſpeaketh reſurrection reproueth men beaſtlineſſe bicauſe cō ſider god doth ſhewe v naturall figure reſurrection growing corne vpon earth looke vpon corne barn drye caſt grounde rotteth vve ſee ſpringeth vp againe one graine commeth vp twentie thirtie ten seeing god reneweth graines bothe wheate corne yea euen rotting hee men vvill vtter farre greater woorke ſenſleſſe brutiſh perceyue manner god worketh confirme v hope life hee hathe promiſed v much thought ſayeth wee ſee tree whiche winter time deade leaſtwiſe ſeemed deade become freſhe greene againe ſpring time muſt cōfirmed god declareth vnto v namely although life hidden heere ſhadow death yet ſhould hinder v lifte vp heades continuallye looke reſurrection hee hath promiſed v yea euen nowe although wee ſeeme deade yet haue wee god ſpirite dwelling v ſufficient warrant oure life whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god take v worlde although body rotte away yet notwithſtanding ſeeyng hee hath printed ſeale holy ſpirite oure ſoules thinke ſhall periſh protector frayltie man lyfe ought ſtirre v vp magnifie god goodneſſe towardes v god wrought order witte hee bringeth v lacke himſelfe fayth hee ſhoulde place v heere little paradiſe ſo ſhoulde like angelles power ſhould ſhew ſelfe v voyde theſe infirmity wee ſee lyfe might bee like ſhadowe vaniſheth away wee bee walled ſo many miſeries god ſhoulde dwel middes v reigne peaſably v verely theſe gracious giſtes ſo well worthy bee highly eſteemed yet ſhoulde wee meane miſtake ſhould know whence come wee ſhould caryed away vaingloriouſneſſe nowe god humbleth v ſo manie wayes wee looke vpon preſent ſtate wee ſee nothing death yet neuertheleſſe parte hee ſheweth v maketh v perceyue bothe experience faith aliue yea verely whoſe lyfe parttakers hee maketh v ſee glaſſe ſayde immortalitie whiche wayte seeing god hee hath humbled v bringeth v hope ſpake haue wee cauſe make much goodneſſe vswarde ſay ala lord thy ſpirite ſhould dwell heere body wormes ſoules nothing wickedneſſe yet notwithſtanding thou lorde haſt choſen body oure ſoules bee temple thy maieſtie thou haſte dedicated vſe lorde howe greatly wee thy dette much boūd vnto thee againe although body heere doo go decay yet wee ſure ſhall bee reſtored againe ſted tranſitory lodging wee haue dwelling place prepared v heauen therefore ought greeue v droope away little little tyll wee bee quite cleane diſpatched seeing wee haue ought ſtirred praiſe god wee ſee howe wee may applie thing oure inſtruction iob turneth euill vſe going expreſſe pang felt whereagainſt fought furthermore wee ſpeake owne ſtate let v marke well one ſide muſt cōſider wee ſelues ſide god able doo power haue ſaide already requiſite men ſhould know thēſelues looke themſelues haue told alſo alredy wit bycauſe neede pricking forwarde vainegloriouſneſſe frayle ſo euer bee yet ſeene moſt parte v ruffile runne riot forget miſeries ought brydle vvee ſee eye euery one v ſhoulde bee infected vice god prouided therefore wee cannot forbeare conſidering miſerie feeblenes oure lyfe wretched thing vvhē know ſhall haue good cauſe miſlike oure ſelues call vpon god praye haue pitie vpon v alſo therewithall muſte conſider power meaſure wee hope whiche wee ſee become vvhat ſhall become reſurrection vvhat ſhall become euerlaſting ſaluation promiſed v vvhat ſhal become heauenly glory likely bodyes rotten ſhall bee parttakers god glory ſee oure ſelues bee ſo frayle muſte companion angel paradiſe ſpecially wee ſhall bee matched ſonne god vvee knowe maieſtie ſoueraintie bothe heauen earth gyuen vnto likely ſhould reſemble wee ſhoulde member body partaker al whiche gyuen vntoo enter intoo man reaſon vvhat bee done lette v acknowledge whiche sainct paule ſayeth philippian god rayſe v vp power whereby made al thing see whether sainct paule ſendeth v hee intendeth ſtrengthen v hope reſurrection ſhould ſay friend let v looke whiche poſsible oure imagination god wyll haue men reſt let v enter higher conſideration whiche god diſpoſeth thing yea euen aboue vnderſtanding inſomuch whē wee thinke vpon work aſtoniſhed without cauſe worketh wōderouſly inſomuch power ſayeth whereby made thing tranſformed glory lorde ieſus chriſt although bodyes nowe weake ſubiect ſo many neceſsities yet ſhall taken heauenly glory thus yee ſee two thing wee haue conſider namely humble oure ſelues one ſide haue certayne infallible hope whiche ſurmounteth capacitie cannot conceyued v caſe bee heerewithall let v gather whiche iob meeneth heere inaſmuch man cannot receyue himſelfe renued tree riuer ſhoulde drye vp water ſhould ſhrinke ſea therfore woulde hee ſhould plaged god hand ſo long world yea cleane contrarie men ſo deſtitute bee cannot holde themſelues pride exceſſe ſtarting bound would correction ſaide afore much god neede abate men pride preſumption whiche cannot eaſily correct ſelfe foraſmuche men ſo lifte vp themſelues againſte god euery man forget himſelfe yea puffed vp hee hath reſt caſe neede chaſtized haue newe correction day day yea verely god ſhould let v rūne race life withoute making v feele roddes quicken v vp haue done amiſſe ala ſhoulde neuer come time vvhereto tende correction god ſendeth v nowadayes call v repentance god ſhould tarry till wee deade gate would ſhut would tyme returning vnto behold ſayeth sainct paule acceptable dayes dayes ſaluation wee bee way god ſhould ſee men go aſtray rūne letthē go till falne downe tūbled headlong pit coulde neuer get thing therefore behoueth v reaſon contrary whiche iob wit ſeeing life ſhort ſo good cace tree let v put cace ſo bicauſe whē departed world ſeemeth periſhed therfore good god ſhould chaſtize v long liue end call v repentance deathe ſhall bee time reſte lette v doubt haue touched afore iob opinion good men bee viſited god hād although ſhunne skoffers whiche alledge iobs example ſhrowding ſheete ſaying beholde holy men haue forgotten hope reſurruction chafed againſt god cōplayned god preſſed ouerſore ſomuche leyſure ſubdue imperfection ſhall lyke bee lawfull v haue declared already although wee bee pacient bearing god chaſtyzementes induring quietlye wee ought yet fayle moued haue oure fleſhe ſhewe ſelfe ſomewhat rebellious v therefore wee cannot come vntoo god ſerue wee ſhall bee aſſayled pricked ſides vvee muſte ſtyll fighte according apoſtle ſayeth wee ſhall get victorye fyghting cheefe battell wee haue fighte agaynſte oure ſelues agaynſte oure owne vice thing wherein wee muſte imploye oure whole force lette v marke whereas iob ſpeaketh heere lyfe man perſone withoute regarde reſurrection come hee reſted wholly vpon poynte hee well foreſeene meant expreſſe paſsion felt end euery v ſhould bethinke himſelfe caryed away ſuch temptation befall v moreouer iob weakened ſort let v aſſure ſelues ſhall weakened much howbeit god whiche aſsiſted like v alſo power inuincible maynteyne v daye hee calleth v daye euen owne goodneſſe abated ſhoulde make v feele well made ſeruants old time fele therfore ſee thing ſo cō founded nowadayes world wote ſay become let v runne good god caſting eye vpon oure lorde ieſus chriſt deliuer v miſeries trouble day world vvell feele ſelues feeble weake let v looke vpon lord ieſus chriſt power god father ſee ſelues good already dead fountaine lyfe come vnto v forſomuch god hath ſent v ſonne end euen draw v dungeon death aſſure v beeing vnited vnto cā neuer ſet beſide ſaluatiō prepared v ye ſee thē haue eye ſettled vpon lord ieſus chriſt ſhall fayle thinke ſelues ſafe wel midds death trouble worlde bicauſe meanes ſure ſhall come heauenly glory wherinto entered v haue finiſhed courſe whiche wee haue runne ſubiect ſo many miſeries let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v perceyue better haue done yet notwithſtanding ſuch ſort may become folke forlorne returne remedie deſiring bee pitifull v ſhewe himſelfe ſame towardes v hath bin towardes time furthermore ſeeing hath pleaſed bee one v perſone lorde ieſus chriſt lorde ieſus chriſt hath giuen owne ſelfe v ſo good gage loue ſpeciallye death paſsion whiche indured ſakes hee ſuffer v forget deſpize ſo greate benefite rather wee may put oure whole truſte meanes ſtirred vp call vppon oure good god oure neceſsities miſeries may pleaſe graunte grace onely v alſo people c lv sermon third vpon xiiij chapter 13 thou vvoldeſt hide graue thou hadſt ſhut vp till thine anger vvere abated thou vvoldeſt ſet time vvherein thinke vpon 14 shall man dead liue agayne dayes battell vvill vvayte till chaunge come 15 thou vvoldeſt anſvvere vvhen call thee thou vvoldeſt fauour vvorke thy handes prophet eſay ſhewing howe horrible god wrath howe heauy beare ſayeth ſuch feele wold faine mountaines ſhoulde hide wiſhe myghte fall downe vpon head lord ieſus chriſt alſo hath vſed ſelfe ſame word done ſhewe v muſt bee ſo dulheaded know thing haue god againſt v true wee ſhall well ynough feele miſcheefe whē perſecuteth v cheefe thing wee haue doo ſtandeth v hande wey throughly god wrath ſo vnderſtand god hande bethinke ſelues ſinnes therevpon wee bee abaſhed perceyue full well muſte needes periſhe except god haue pitie vpon v howbeeit foraſmuche ſhunne feeling lorde exerciſeth v make v thoughly awake intendeth ſhewe v mercie thus yee ſee gathered iobs woordes ſayth thou woldest hide graue hee preferred death life cace bicauſe wold haue eſcaped god hand bin poſsible knew well far terribler matter haue god iudge die hundred time ought touch v neerer make v thinke better vpon ſinnes wee haue done end may knowe wee ſhall haue indured miſeries worlde nothing compariſon appeering god iudgemēt ſeate commeth yeelding vp account ſicke little wee cry ala happen v miſchance men ſhall heare v make complaint yet ſinnes ſhall buryed neuer come thought remembrance heereby wee ſhewe howe vntoward iudging thing therefore oft wee heare thoſe whiche haue bin ſcourged god hand haue deſired death hidden graue let v aſſure ſelues ſame thing whiche ought feare aboue witte god ſheweth himſelfe aduerſarie agaynſte v perſwaded ſame greateſt daunger befall vnto man wee wyll laboure meanes retourne vnto vvhen oure ſinnes come minde ala wee ſay cace god ſhew himſelfe enemie ſhall wee doe cace ſhall wee bee let v preuent matter behold wee ſhall ſo prouoked ſeeke vnto god grace ſhall neuer reſt till hee bee one v thus ye ſee vſe wherevnto ought applie leſſon wee muſt marke well howe hee ſaith would fayue thou baddest hidden graue ſhut vp vntill ſucke tyme cut heere hee ſheweth wherefore hee deſireth deathe namely bycauſe hee felt himſelfe ſhutte vp vnder god iudgement could find way ſcape hereby bee warned ſtartingholes ſhall ſerue v purpoſe ende haue fisked hither thither neuer ſo much muſt fayne ſhut vp vve ſhall haue profited well one day beare leſſon mind vvhy ſo although god threaten v neuer ſo much yet ſeene needeth thing make v beleue able ſhift according euerie v imagineth one ſhift inſomuch hypocriſie cauſe god threatnings pierce hart requiſite nothing prouoketh god extreeme vengeance hee ſees wee make none account wrath lo prouoketh extreemely let v learne ſayd whenſoeuer god liſteth pinch v good earneſt ſcaping v neither one meanes muſt fayne faſt ſhut vp ſide god giue v reſpite ſpecially hee ſhewe v howe wee may obteyne fauour hande let v vſe oportunitie ſayde immediately woulde thou haddeſt hidden graue might bee demaunded death token god wrath curſe comming thither reliefe vvhat doth boote v verely ſeemeth bee vttermoſt extremitie god cannot ſhewe greater rigour vpon v put v death iob hath conceyued death amiſſe haue ſhewed heretofore muſt beare well minde hee ouerpreſſed anguiſh bycauſe god made feele miſerie therevpon bethinketh himſelfe might bee rid leaſtwiſe ſayth ſhould wander darke long beare fleſh ſayth concluſion ende ſo long ſoule payne tormented haue nothing diſtreſſe god taken worlde ſhoulde haue ſome caſe woulde ende hee hath ſayde afore ſhould haue end hireling ye ſee reſt terme ende couenant come thus ye ſee deſireth bee ſhet vp graue furthermore let v marke hee knewe well ynoughe men ceaſſe bee vnder god hande dying muſt fayne iudged feele ſtill iob knewe well ynough meane eye miſerie preſſed ſo faſt tyed therevnto hee thought reſt yee ſee god perſecuteth poore ſinner hee hath reſpect ſay ala muſt bee encloſed without remedie muſt miſerie encreaſe periſh end bicauſe god neuer leaue purſuing ſinner hath reſpect thing ſo harde beare cauſe thought death nothing ſhoulde ſerue ſalue ſores maner ſpake iob deſiring couered graue locked vp ſame ſayth vntill thou bethinke thee vntill thou ſet day thereby hee ſheweth howe ſome feeling ſtill euen death howbeeit ſeeming caryed away rauiſhed ſhall ſome reſpite take breath inſo▪ much ſhail gone worlde ſhall ſuch confuſion ſo harde heauie cace felt haue ſayde iob coulde knowe euen death wee haue account make ſayth wayte graue
