vntill thou appoynt time bethinke thy ſelfe bethinking nothing elſe god calling creature iudgement iob ſo troubled wit ſayde paſsion ſo turmoyle iudged ſo ſetled minde ought doo firſt formoſt ſo long liue worlde ſhoulde wee deſire god ſhoulde haue v remembrance forget v ſhall become v peter ſayde get thee away mee lorde wretched ſinner yea muſt go contrarie way worke ſay lorde come neerer v without thy grace nothing needfull god ſhould remember v mainteine preſerue v ſo vpholde v haue pitie vpon feebleneſſe releeue ſame guide v prouidence ye ſee god muſt fayne remember v elſe ſtate verie miſerable nothing ought ſo much afrayd forgotten god lo one poynt although god take v oute worlde yet forgetteth hee v though ſeeme forget v hee keepeth thoſe alwayes hand cuſtodie thoſe damned reſerued chaynes vntill day executing ſentence ye ſee god doth alwayes beare v minde ſcripture ſayth hath forgotten v bicauſe perceyue preſent ſuccors like poore man lingreth paine deſire god helpe feele helpe ſees likelyhod god heareth thus ye ſee ſort ſayde hath forgotten v wit ought perceyue yet hee remembreth v continually iob amiſſe ſurmize dead ſhould forgotten til god ſhould cal vp al creature latter day ſummon iudgement ſeate iob therefore conſider remembrance god towards v ſo well requiſite may well ſee perſwaded haue ſayde namely god ceaſſeth think vpon v though leaue v little ſo body rot earth ſoules abide ſuſpence wayting day wherein world ſhall repayred moreouer ſo long wee liue let v fully reſolued nothing better v haue god thinke vpon v yea euen though puniſh v god thinke vpon v make v feele fauor • therein conſiſteth ioy glorie according ſayde eight pſalme ala man god ſhould vouchſafe looke vpon watch ouer vve little ſhadow nothing yet pleaſeth god haue fatherly ca • e ou • life ought wee acknowledge wonderfull goodneſſe behalfe wee muſt highly eſteeme ſayde mercie god ſheweth v minde full v euen make v feele goodneſſe ſayde although choſtice v ſinnes yet 〈…〉 gracious v thereby ſheweth loth ſhould periſh hee calleth v backe againe ſeeth v high way deſtruction chaſtizings many warning giueth v come repentance ye ſee ought ſet ſtore god grace hee mindefull v deſire forget v effect wee haue remember concerning ſentence enſueth shall • n dead liue agayne looke chaunge dayes battell trauell heerein iob ſheweth howe ſore troubled minde better hee afore hee ſuche diſtreſſe hee wiſt ende men whether ſhoulde rayzed againe bee deade truely ſeemeth ſtraunge firſt bluſhe wee muſte marke haue ſayde afore namelye iob ſpeaketh former temptation whiche hee withſtoode great difference betweene beeing vtterly beaten downe temptation betweene feeling beeing ſhaken yet meane withſtande vvhat number euill opinion fancy come heade according wee knowe men receyue many mockeryes satan hande beholde one wicked fancie commeth heade wee greatly diſtruſt god wee ſhoulde ſay canſt thou tell whither god think vppon thee howe knoweſt thou whether hee hath giuen thee ouer vvhat woteſt thou whither vouchſafe looke towardes mortall men beholde thoughtes men haue euer among make v humble ſelues foraſmuch ſee ſelues ſo full vanitie haue ſo much need walke feare god ſay ala thing ought imploy wit glorifying god beholde moſt part wit occupied ſuche maner thoughtes yea come outrageous blaſphemies heade greatly ought men bee greeued themſelues conceyue ſuch fancy faithfull doo repulſe incontinently aſſoone diuell go trouble v faſhion bee armed god worde fence ſelues buckler fayth ſcripture ſpeaketh although diuell caſt firie dart v paul ſayth yet enter ſo ſoules woūd v poyſō thē perceth ſo deepe v true satan aſſault v mightily yet ſting ſhall neither deadly infectiue vve ſhal repulſe theſe wicked conceyts ſo aſſayled ſort wholy poſſeſſed ſo farre ſquare ſome doubt god prouidence otherſome thinke god hath vtterly reiected meanes whereof vtterly vnder foote great difference betwixt fleeting fancie commeth head withſtand ſure perſwaſion ſettleth ſelfe taketh root v true wee ſhall haue fought againſt al temptation satan ouercome yet ſhall come full ende wee muſt mourne ſtill god bicauſe wee haue glorified ſo perfitly requiſite neuerthelater hee accepteth ſuch ſted faſtneſſe reſiſt euil maner see iob hath delt behalf reherſeth temptation wherwith aſſayled yet ouercome verely three degree noted ſomtimes come fancy minde driue away hande sometymes ſhall payne diſtreſſe ſo wee ſhall almoſt tyred ſay howe ſhall outweare temptation yet ende satan preſſeth v therewith god dooth ſtill ſtrengthen v thirde degree wee bee vtterly borne downe ouercome iob onely came firſt degree haue fleeting fancie aske whether men ſhall riſe againe alſo hee came ſeconde ſtep temptation ſawe himſelfe ſo preſſed miſerie hee thought himſelfe intendeth god mee ſeemeth hee minded wipe quite away ſeeing haue hym mine enemie ſhall become mee iob tormented temptation euill bicauſe marked howe god ſo agaynſt yet ouercome although battell verie ſore hard endure yet gat vpper hande thus yee ſee ſort wee muſt take ſentence iob ſettled opinion beene curſed blaſphemie aske whether man ſhall riſe againe ſurely hee aſſayled ſuch wiſe yet neuertheleſſe hee abode ſtyll beleefe hee conceyued ſpirite god gaue vpper hande vvee muſte therefore charge blaſphemie ſo dooing neyther muſte wee condemne misbeleefe fayth withoute fighting behoueth hir bee throughly exercized howe done diuels caſting many occaſions vnbeleefe misbeleefe way thus yee ſee true tryall fayth iob muſt bee caſt number companie faythfull beeing ſo aſſaulted alſo bee noted hee alonely doubt alſo ſo caryed away bycauſe preſſed god hande iob bene demaunded whether men periſh vtterly dying hee woulde haue anſwered although bodie rot away god rayſe againe ſoule reſerued till laſt day whiche time ſhall wholy reſtored iob woulde ſurely haue anſwered ſo bin examined death generall foraſmuch cace nowe become peculiar himſelf bicauſe god pincheth ſo ſore hee woteth become inſomuch ſeemeth god fully determined confounde ouerwhelme euer ſore diſmayd therat cauſe doubting therfore let v mark iob eie owne perſon wit god rigor ſo great likelihood euer ſhould get miſerie wherin cauſe ſayth shall man dead riſe ▪ verely hee meeneth death cace god vttereth force bring manne naught hee ſhoulde ſay ala lorde ſeemeth thou art mynded barre mee hope whiche thou haſte gyuen v oure ryſing agayne ſeeing thou handleſt mee ſo rygorouſly dooth thys ſtraunge dealing thou vſeſt towardes mee tende vtter fordooing thou haſt fordone make mee vp againe ſurmiſing god put ouer time vtterly root number creature cauſe demaū deth whither poſsible man come life dead bicauſe god dealeth ſo ſtraūgely may ſeeme hee minded bring vtterly naught hereby warned pray god handle v ſo meaſurably may alwayes haue hope aſſure ſelues miſerie ſhal endure euer god remedie office rayze graues belecue wee muſt needes fall horrible diſpayre diſmay v wee ſee happened vnto iob god hilde vp ſtrong hand ye ſee alſo ſayd lord chaſtice howbeeit reaſon god time vnreaſonable worde reaſon iudgement ieremiement moderate faſhion agreeable oure infirmitie bee tempted ſo ſtrongly wee may alwayes perceyue god pitie v ende remedie miſeries thus ye ſee wherof bee admoniſhed text demaunded whether man deade ſhall liue againe touching inſueth namely wayte till day chaunging come ſome men expound iob wiſt god woulde rayze deade hope reſurrection renewment hee woulde wayte day muſt bee taken plainly wit lorde comfort nowe wittes ende▪ ſee thou vſeſt nothing force ſee thou executeſt thing violence agaynſt mee ſo muſt ſtill fight ſtreyne ſelfe vttermoſt haue none comfort waite day change see effect ſort iob vnderſtoode ſaying hee rather reaſoneth himſelfe wyth god whether man ſhall returne lyfe againe deade hee ſhoulde ſay ſee ſelfe heere ſo▪ wretched ſtate mine owne ſeeming muſt bee vtterly terly confounded meanes recouerie ſith god agaynſt mee minded bring naught bee ſayde yet heerevpon hee inforceth himſelfe calleth courage concluding thus yet wayte day chaunge heereby therefore wee perceyue iob gat vpper hande wanne prize battell notwithſtanding entered debate whether ſhoulde rize agayne yet ende ſayth beholde wayte day chaunge yea euen time trauell ſayd true long time laſteth wiſhe god ſhoulde keepe mee ſhette vp graue hee ſhoulde caſte mee intoo ſome dungeon ſhoulde cauſe hilles fall vpon mee yet muſt tarie leyſure ſtill yea euen middes affictions wherein although harde vnable indured yet notwithſtanding foraſmuche chaunge ſame muſt ſuffice giue ſome comfort nouriſh obedience god ſee meening iobs word haue good profitable leſſon picke ſaying firſt whenſoeuer wee aſſayled satan tormented naughtie ymaginations ſpecially commeth diſtruſt leade v diſpayre wee muſt make theſe diſputations quickly ſhortly conclude reſolue ſelues vpon god truth howe haue pleaſure intangle themſelues lewde imagination come ſome opinion theyr heade yea euen ſome opinion lewde tendeth euen daſhing themſelues agaynſt god heerevpon fall debating imagining whether ſame poſsible howe fareth therefore heades runne vpon wheeles ſort fall chawing vpon bitte hatching ſo lewde opinion cleane contrarie fayth one men ſhould fall deuifing ſtate wyth enemy come beſiege theyr citie giue eare allowe counſell deſtruction whole towne ſet opē gate one euen ſo thoſe ſnarle themſelues owne lewde opinion satan putteth theyr heades abyde ende leading deſtruction vvhat bee done let v followe experience ſhewed v heere iob verely hee aſſaulted daungerouſly doubted whether ſhould euer rize ſeing god brought ſo low hee continued minde ende thing beene hee beene ſo aſſayled cutteth matter hande ſayth tarie day chaunge howe ſo euer ſpeede lo haue namely conclude according god truth alſo conceyue lewd imagination may turne v fayth way ſaluation wee muſt come backe take holde ſome ſentence ſcripture ſee ſelues fenced god truth concluſion muſt wee diſpute ſeeing god hath ſpoken thus ye ſee ſouerein remedie wee haue beate backe satan behalfe wit goeth turne v aſide fayth obeying god worde furthermore iob fayth tarie chaunge worde deſerueth weyed throughly verely ſpeaketh reſurrection therefore meeneth muſt wholly renued ſo corruption whiche v reaſon adam ſin vtterly done away god receyue v immortalitie kingdom lo chaunge whereof iob ſpeaketh ſame alſo thing muſt haue eie vnto without reſurrection wee cannot comfort ſelues neyther wil al euer man alledge ſufficient cheere v vvee ſee alſo holy ſcripture directeth faythfull thither purpoſeth content giue aſſured ſettled reſt ye ſure ſay ſeruants god wee bee called bee partaker heauenly glorie god hath promiſed thoſe therefore ye glad howbeeit better aſſurance laſt chaunge wee muſt conſider chaunges god maketh day▪ euen courſe life howe god maketh many alteration v whereby giueth v alreadie ſome taſte laſt chaunge example vve ſome trouble well ſhet vp vvhen wee looke ende wee ſee none remedie paſt recouerie forlorne ſodenly god hath ſuch pitie vpon v deliuered hand see ye chaunge ought lead v forth vnderſtande muche perfecter deliuerance theſe wee perceyue day particularly let v learne acquaint ſelues well chaunges god maketh dayly wee may bee lifted vp high meanes quiet till time renued kingdome heauen alſo heere yee ſee maner dauid hath ſpoken ſpeaketh chaunges god hand whether reſcuing men trouble caſting ſaying great weight though ſeeme ſo men haue alwayes fonde opinion concerning fortune ſay see ill fortune befalne mee ſee good fortune happened mee bee chaunges god hande poynt muſt wee alwayes bee brought howbeeit among chaunges made worlde liuelyeſt image laſt renewment god quickning v holye ſpirite inlightning v fayth making v newe creature oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſcripture ſpeaketh let v conſider birth men true wee come intoo worlde wee bring ſome remnant god image wherein adam created howbeeit ſame image ſo disfygured bee full vnrightuouſneſſe nothing blindneſſe ignorance minde yee ſee ſtate men byrth god inlightneth v holy ſpirite yea euen ſuche wiſe wee able beholde ſo farrefoorth expedient transforming v intoo glorie reforming v holy ſpirite therefore god ſhall haue ſo chaunged v wee feele dwelling v meanes thereof wee fight agaynſt wicked luſtes whereas men doo ordinarily delight vice bathe themſelues ſeeke cleane contrarie ſo euill ſoeuer v ſame miſlikes v mourne therewithall follow good altogither deſirous giue ſelues ouer ſeruing god woonderfull chaunge ſuch maner dooings neuer ſpring ſelues vvhen wee taſte god goodneſſe ſo ſure fatherly loue towardes v ſpecially haue certentie ſaluation call vpon father see yee chaunge able ſhewe howe mightifull god hand men owne nature neuer open mouthes call vppon god truth true may well haue ſome ceremony heathen folke pray vntoo god papiſtes alſo doo babble make prayer long ynough nothing bicauſe bee aſſured theyr prayer fully perſwaded god ſhould bee father wee ſee god willing heare v wee deſirous ſerue honour euen much chaunged v caſte v newe agayne mowlde though put v newe againe making doubtleſſe naught scripture calleth v new creature oure lorde ieſus chriſt place wee ſayde workemanſhip bicauſe hee hath created v good woorkes saint paule meeneth god hath created v onely bee mortall men alſo entent wee ſhould good workes therfore god dooth ſo chaunge faythfull one yee ſee ſpeciall woorke wherein vttereth power aboue nature heere ye ſee ſayde muſt take holde ſuch chaunges haue aſſured hope reſurrection doubt whether god renue v laſt day muſt come hath god chaunged v alreadie purpoſe doth hee put grace v purpoſe ſhall haue giuen v courage ſerue honour purpoſe alſo ſhall haue giuen v ſpirit adoption aſſure v hope haue euerlaſting glorie purpoſe chaunge perceyue ſelues nowe infallible witneſſe heauenly glorie ſee yet hid v god giueth v good erneſt pennie according ſayde holye ghoſt erneſt pennie pledge bicauſe effectes holy ghoſt ydle v rather ſheweth openly dwelleth v make v child god ſoner god child muſt enforce ſelues good workes followe ye ſee wyze faythfull ought practize leſſon iob ſayeth precizely hee wyll wayte chaunge dayes hys trauell vvhich ſaying woorthie well marked toſſed neuer ſo many trouble ynough vppon ſome good motion affection ſay nowe muſt wee truſt god nothing vnleſſe holde yea euen middes incounters firſt therefore let v marke hope dayes byrde monethes byrde muſt continue ende doubtleſſe bee fully ſettled vpon god promiſes hee holdeth v ſtill ſame ende wee may quayle euerie day haue ouerpaſſed ſome time wee maye alwayes ſtabliſhed vntill god haue perfourmed thing whiche yet delayed another time ye ſee thē booteth haue ſome good affection haue truſted god except continue ſo throughout iob hath expreſſed ſame thing plainlyer vnder woorde trauell • attell ſo meeneth wee go god eaſe ſee well ynough long ſuffer nothing finde harte liue ſtill worlde prolong life double poſsible deſire god ſhoulde handle v without greeuing v pleaſe v reſpects obey v deſires see howe eaſily would paſſe time wee might go owne pace might haue temptation might heauineſſe feare ſuche thing elſe ſayde muſt giue attendance life long yea euen fighting theſe wordes dayes ſhewed v time linger ſeeme long v muſt take excuſe doo euill bee greeued giue ouer mids iourney muſt continue end vnder woorde battell fighting expreſſed vnto v ſtate preſent life wayfarer world muſt faine fight beſeeged ſides continuall perill bee tempted ſometimes care ſometimes aduerſities ſometime ſome daunger therefore let v thinke vpon herewithall let v vnderſtande alſo muſt fight agaynſt luſtes owne fleſh notwithſtanding diſtreſſes yet muſt ſtill wayt chaunge thus ye ſee haue beare away ſtreyne concluſion iob ſayeth thou wouldest anſwere calleth thee thou wouldeſt accept worke thine owne hande ſerueth larger declaration matter come treate intent ſhewe chaunge hath wayted god ſhoulde gracious worke owne handes surely ſome expounde preſent ſtreyn god would beare worke hand conſtreyned therfore meening nothing elſe wil quietly abide god leyſure til ſhew effect accept creature cauſe ſayeth anſwere whenſoeuer thou calleſt iob proteſteth ſhun god ſhrinke backe hee calleth readie come yea euen cheerfull courage knoweth god ſhewe himſelf pitifull towardes thus ye ſee thing haue marke ſtreyne effect euen mids trouble ſeemeth god ſore diſpleaſed v ſhall come attonement yea recken v number creature come paſſe yet neuertheleſſe muſt fight agaynſt ſuch diſpayre vntill haue gotten ſo much hope chaunge wayt see text ought prouoke v bee good comfort aduerſities pray god ſtrengthen v ſo power although toſſed fro many ſtormes yet may ceaſſe kepe way ſtill towards make doubt comming thither howſoeuer worlde go although ſeeme haue caſt v angrie v yet returne vnto cal vpon anſwere v ſtabliſh hope welfare making v feele loue beareth v wee may bee throughly perſuaded doubt let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele ſame maye bee meane prouoke v returne vntoo true repentance may proſper therein till hee haue taken v miſeries worlde gather v kingdome ſhall inioy euerlaſting reſt full whereof nowe giueth v taſte holy ghoſt may pleaſe graunt grace onely vnto v alſo c lvj sermon fourth vpon xiiij chapter sermon conteyneth reſt expoſition xv verſe text followeth 16 novv thou reckneſt ſteppes makeſt delay vpon ſinne 17 miſdeede ſealed bundell thou haſt added mine iniquitie 18 mountayne periſheth infalling dovvne rocke vvaſteth 19 vvaters conſume ſtones thou deſtroyeſt earth vvith floudes vvaters thou takeſt avvay hope man miſerie 20 thou vttereſt thy force ouercome thou couereſt face ſendeſt avvay 21 knovveth vvhither ſonnes exalted vvhither oppreſſed diſtreſſed 22 fleſh mourneth ſo long vpon ſoule ſorrovv wee ſawe yeſterday wiſe wee may anſwere god ſay wyſe wee maye come freely vntoo namely knowing hee loueth v hee accepteth v woorke hande ſo long wee knowe whither god miſliketh v muſt needes afrayd ſhun preſence much poſſible ſo ye ſee cace wretched creature haue taſt god goodneſſe truſt might comfort themſelues therefore let v marke well behoueth v perſuaded god loue towardes v thereby may conceyue ſuch truſt may preſent ſelues vnto well aſſured ſoueraigne welfare anſwere ſay hyde ſelues ſight bee alwayes willing guided hand ſo deſire nothing vnder hande direction way haue conſider theſe wordes woorke thine handes thing wherein wee may ſettle oure truſt acceptable god hee hath created v muſt wee pretende bee loued god hande deſertes owne bycauſe hee ſees wee workemanſhip true wee woorkemanſhip alreadie wee bee men yet wit hath faſhioned v new owne image grace lorde ieſus chriſt vvhen holy ghoſt teacheth v ſhould pray vnto god ſetteth theſe wordes afore v lorde thy workemanſhip maner ſaid eſay likewiſe foureſcoure fiftenth pſalme vve thy flocke work thy handes textes lorde thou wilt deſpiſe woorke thine handes thou wilt forſake thou haſt begunne without finiſhing yee ſee whereof ought take occaſion truſt god agreeable vntoo come vntoo ſure readie receyue v euen bicauſe creature hath formed v caſt away thing commeth himſelfe marke one poynt howbeeit ſayde wee muſt looke onely firſt creation hope ſhall haue thereby verie ſlender bicauſe god image blotted oute v adam ſinne foraſmuch god owne infinite mercie hath renued v adopted v bee child lorde ieſus chriſt imprinted image agayne v therein wee bee woorekmanſhippe maye come heades vpright call vpon aſſure ſelues hee ſhake v wee ſhall bee welcome therefore let v marke well ſtreyne according profitableneſſe thereof men wretched cace know whether god doo loue muſte needes bee afrayde ſame fearefulneſſe muſt needes cauſe ingender rebelliouſneſſe ſo ſhun god eſchue hand much ſtriue agaynſt ye ſee men wilde beaſtes cannot ſubmit themſelues vntoo god vntill ſuch time know loueth contrarie ſide wee knowe god fauoreth v wee bold approch vnto yea euen anſwere ſay yeeld ourſelues ſimply take good worth whatſoeuer hee doth diſpozeth v yea although hee ſcourge v torment v put v diſtreſſe yet muſt wee ſtill flee vnto hath care ſaluation bring v therevnto ſhall done deſertes bicauſe god woont poure grace vpon v bicauſe beholden good thing haue thus ye ſee wee acknowledge ſelues alreadie bounde exceedingly vnto god yet notwithſtanding ſtill increaſe grace v vntill haue brought v full perfection may doubt wil performe al hath begon v lo effect haue beare minde concerning ſtreyne therevpon iob entereth againe intoo complaintes maruell though ſo although god child comfort themſelues middes ſorowes ſet eies thing may giue good hope yet cannot toſſed ſome trouble haue indured one battell muſt bee faine enter ſecond third see minde iob tooke ſentence haue ſeene reſolue himſelfe might come freely vnto god reaſon bicauſe god accepteth worke owne handes beholde aſſayled new againe thou numbrest ſteppes ſayth delayeſt ſinne text thou keepeſt ſinne worde keepe ſignifieth watch wayte vpon effect iobs meening is▪ god iudgement preſſeth exceſsiuely howbeit ſpeaketh man wel eaſe mind certaine god alwayes ſlow wrath himſelfe telleth v wee ſelues ſee vvhich v perceyueth god vſeth great long ſufferance towards v haue offended hee haſtie puniſh v ſhould become v ſee god doth well ynough keepe ſinnes ſay put vp puniſhe ſo rigorouſly haue deſerued vvherefore iob complayneth ſo bicauſe felt himſelfe ſhet vp ſuche anguiſh able indure looketh rightly vnto god neither able iudge aright ſuch trouble hee complayneth according hys greefe hereby ſee bee ſo heddie affection cannot iudge god work ſetled minde therefore maruell though moſte tymes glorifie god requiſite ought doo paſsions doo ſo carrie v away god doo v good yet hee content v like vnſatiable gulfes wee thinke doth v little hee ought doo euery thing wee woulde haue againe hee chaſtize v ſo tender pitie ſee fall murmuring thinke rigorous although hee handle v gentle faſhion yet cannot deeme ſo cauſe owne outrageous affection ye ſee howe god glorified handes ought bicauſe blinded affection fleſh trouble v ſuch wiſe cannot haue moderate ſure iudgement much ought wee fight agaynſt ſuch temptation beat backe ende may acknowledge god handleth v iuſtice equitie doings faultleſſe according reaſon ende wee may conceyue thing affection muſt bee thruſt downe kept priſoners fell iob deeme amiſſe god iudgements ſee hath done betide v haue profited hundred parte hee notwithſtanding iob ſomewhat borne withal bicauſe god haue ſayde heeretofore handled extraordinarie faſhion bee well conſidered greater condemnation thoſe diſcontented god though haue wayted long pacience howe beholde man hath committed many offence whome god hath long ſpared forced ende feele ſome correction otherwiſe hee woulde ſtill keepe owne race therefore god puniſheth nowe ſoone bee touched hande wee fall cry ala lamenting thoughe ouerrigorous towardes v yet notwithſtanding wee cannot denie hee hath delt gently louingly v deferring puniſhment due v hee puniſh one ſinne haue committed hundred ſend v correction ſurely ſhall light compariſon haue deſerued wee iobs cace ſo god preſſed v yea knew wherefore made v feele ſinnes haue ſene minded ſet v vpon ſcaffolde example others afflicted v ſo without ſhewing v howe ſore woulde euery v bee greeued diſquieted oft god viſiteth v wyth roddes let v looke homewarde thinke well vpon ſinnes conſider wee haue long time afore deſerued god ſhould ſhew v ſuch rigor whereas haue bin borne withall touched firſt day let v acknowledge ſelues beholding therfore ſame proceeded infinit mercie preſent afflicting v bicauſe wee haue cōpelled prouoking much ſins ſhort wee haue abuſed goodneſſe grace wherethrough bore forbore v ſo long time togither thus ye ſee haue note furthermore let v quarell god though put vp ſins thing man haue euill lurking purged euill become vncureable whereas might well remedied delayed long vve ſee commeth thoſe ſhun phiſicke vvhen inconuenience comming vpon v foreſeene refuze take purgation preuent miſchief forſlow prouide till growne full paſt time deale diſeaſe haue gotten vpper hande ſtrong feuer come vpon man diſeaſe bee taken let alone ye ſee ſwelleth rankleth ynough make partie loſe lymme yea whole bodie kindle burning feuer ſo ſhall meanes heale euen ſo v god ſhould put vp ſinnes ſilence euen ranckling increaſe payne hee ſhould come purge v would late ſo god ſheweth v great fauor clenſeth v ſinnes according knoweth bee meete welfare therefore wee haue cauſe complaine rather glorifie hath care v ſpecially taryeth till aske thing profite preuenteth v correcting couert diſeaſe within v thus much concerning ſtreyne nowe iob addeth ſinne ſealed vp god hath added miſdoings worde adde taken ſenſe many men expound wit god ſhould make iobs iniquity greater like cruell man woont light pardonable fault committed maketh heynous vnpardonable crime ſo thys ſaying god added iobs miſdeedes ſhoulde bee ment god make greater heynous deede text ſheweth tendeth another ende new thing ſpecially iob pſalmes ſee repetition verie ordinarie matter hebrew tung let v looke content verſe iob borroweth ſimilitude namely god hath bound vp ſinnes bundle locked vp togither cheſt ſet ſeale ſhoulde ſay nothing ſhoulde eſcape therevnto addeth god hath layd good weyght vpon like zacharie ment god ſhetteth vp men ſinnes ſayde god layeth maſſe leade vpon veſſell wherein ſo hee hath ſhet vp veſſell hee layeth maſſe leade vppon ſhoulde get iob continueth heere ſimilitude hee ſet downe ſaying god hath ſealed vp ſinnes entent nothing ſhoulde eſcape ſhoulde bee ſo much one poynt left expreſſe hee ſayth god hath added good counterpeyſe weight ſo nothing bee drawne away miſdeedes muſt abyde god come account bee iudged condemned nowe wee ſee plaine meening ſentence verely iob ſome occaſion ſpeake ſo bicauſe haue ſayde hee preſſed extraordinarie faſhion god cuſtome handle men ſo roughly iob therefore ſome occaſion make complaint yet muſt alwayes come backe haue touched namely hee forced exceſsiue paſsions therefore hilde meaſure certaine god liſted haue puniſhed rigour could haue founde exceeding great ſinnes haue made feele farre greater chaſtizement conſidereth god woont men thervpon maketh complaint ſide haue firſt conſider wee bee farre perfection iob therefore whenſoeuer lorde puniſheth oure ſinnes let v aſſure ſelues chaſtize v one two three foure yea great number mo let euery v call himſelf account haue well examined life ſhall find gulf ſin v shall euery man bee faine confeſſe aſhamed himſelf let men ſummon themſelues let thē ſearch little life godward▪ vve hipocrites dullard aſhamed ſelues good ouerwhelmed confuſion cace sith ſo god himſelf condemneth v ſay ſuffer ſinnes doth v wrong ala ought know letteth ſlip great ſort ſinnes yea euen moſt part deſirous puniſh v rigorouſly giueth v occaſion bethink v ſinnes leyſure ſory thē aske forgiueneſſe thus ye ſee haue marke ſentence herewithall let v marke alſo iob acknowledged owne ſinnes entēt ſhould think ment iuſtifie himſelfe heretofore doth theſe ſhameleſſe perſons thinke themſelues without ſpot yea god det iob went way worke iuſtified haue tolde alreadie ſort namely acknowledging god yet iob dooth put himſelfe intoo aray ſinners hee knoweth well god finde faultes ynough neuerthelater greeueth god ſhoulde handle ſo exceſsiue vnaccuſtomed rigor hereby muſt wee take warning looke god doth vnto men thing oftentimes driueth v impacience murmuring vvee ſee god puniſheth thoſe ſeeming haue offended greatly wee yea beholde ſay wee god beareth ſuch one ſee hee compared togither woulde bee founde hath offended therevpon conclude god keepeth ſo euen hand ſuch vprightneſſe hee ought aſhamed blaſph • eme ſo yet ceaſſe repyne ſay dealing vvherfore dooth god puniſhe mee ſinnes meane ſee letteth others alone better looke vppon neighbour ſhall finde faultie ſelfe yet ſee god handleth ſo rigorouſly doth thus ye ſee howe men greeued heart looke heere fonde faſhion paſſe ſelues euery man ought ſhet eye looke god doth vnto folkes let content v rightuous hee handle mee rigorouſly thoſe take bee offender ſelfe well hee knoweth good expedient mee hee hath reaſon hidde mee behoueth mee bee contented wyth hys therevpon ſubmit ſelfe ſimply vnto furthermore wee bee greatly blame alſo wee take vppon v iudge oure neighbour wee inhaunce faultes leſſen owne although wee knowe tenth part faultes haue committed yet wee ouer ſharpe ſighted marke beare awaye men doo yea whiche worſe although thing bee good yet ſo malicious wee ceaſſe condemne therefore let v forbeare ſuch maner condemnings whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god handle v rigorouſly let v aſſure ſelues hee hath iuſt cauſe doo although ſame vnknowne v nowe thus ye ſee wee haue remember ſentence immediately iob addeth mountayne goeth decay rockes melt water bolloweth ſtones man miſerie destroyed god ſpecially god vtter force agaynſt men opinion iob dooth heere compare death mountaynes rockes stone ſhould ſay mountaynes conſume ſo doo rockes death endureth euer death keepeth ſtill ſtrength liuelineſſe vvhat ment conſtruction ouerforced men may perceyue otherſome thinke iob weary lingring ſo long therevpon hee ſayeth howe nowe cannot ſee mine ende deſire death death commeth were▪ mountayne might vndermyned whyle rocke might droppe downe wee ſee rockes fall intoo deepe sea ſtone needed water eate hollowe ſee ſea ouerflowe bankes marreth whole countrey come great rage water maketh ſuche hauocke neyther feeld lande cattell houſe▪ thing elſe remayneth vnturned vp poore frayle creature ſo ſturdie mountaynes yet al cannot die verely expoſition meetely conuenient draweth nie true naturall meening howbeeit iob ment ſimplie mountaynes conſume god vſeth violence towardes according muſt needes great force ſhall conſume mountaynes rockes beholde iob ment vvho lorde ſayth thou ſeeſt nothing weakeneſſe mee yet howe doeſt thou chaſtice thou neededſt touch thy little finger yea thou neededſt come neere mee giue puffe beholde vndone god looke vpon v angrie countenance looke nothing death deſtruction god needeth arme himſelfe gard himſelfe great power ouercome ſilie creature leſſe thā nothing therfore vſe great violence though hee woulde thunder vpon mountaynes though hee ment ouerturne rock cliue aſunder ſcatter ſtones reaſon ſo dooing thus ye ſee iob ment ſay muſt always remember iob ſpeaketh man right wit man conſidereth thing ought doo might mind reaſon flingeth himſelf bound agaynſt god ſheweth maner hee bin toſſed ſhaken reſiſted temptation haue ſayd afore bicauſe felt ſo vehemēt temptation himſelf reaſon vexation torment howbeeit withſtood grace god perceiue god plague v cannot ſhall troubled looke vpon others ſame augmenting owne miſerie much muſt bridle affection therwithal reſort vnto god may pleaſe reſtreyne luſtes ſuffer v time ouerſhoote ſelues moreouer intendeth humble v therevpon giueth v bridle ſuch wiſe cannot refraine chafing againſt afflicteth v may pleaſe graunt v grace reſiſt fight ſtill ſuffer v • ide thoſe murmuring chafe ſtill vpon bit may ſo maiſter ſelues apparāt working holy ſpirit may ſubdue fleſh hold ſelues true ſubiection may diſpoſe v glorifie doings thus ye ſee haue beare away firſt place ſentence reſt ſayeth man miſerable hath ſuch ſtore miſeries cannot well expreſſed meeneth conclude thereby god ought purſue men ſo ſore way let v looke little vpon hardneſſe v god afflicteth v though beaten neuer ſo much ſeene euer whit ſofter bowe neckes winneth v become teachable obedient ala ſee god may make ſame complaynt theſe dayes made prophet eſays time ſhall ſayth ſoale foote crowne heade whole part people god wearie bicauſe chaſtized people ſo muche aſſayde bring amendment vvell yee ſee heere people beaten double beaten forwo • e wyth plague warres famine generally particularly finally become like wretched lepres rotte owne affliction yet ſtyll ſtubburne ſtubburne euer afore yee ſee lorde dealeth behalfe father ſeeth amendmente hys child greeued hart notwithſtandyng al correction vſeth yet child altogither ſtubborne vnreformable therefore hee maketh moane ſaying ala thing haue loſt labour euen ſo doth god complayne people ſee much ſelues day let v marke although miſerable haue many default v yet ceaſſe wee therefore ſtill hard harted ſtubborne yea reſpect blind pride feerce preſumptuouſneſſe v reſpect rebellion wilfull ſtubbornneſſe theſe thing exceede mountaines rockes notwithſtāding little ſhadow ſmoke therefore let v thinke ſtrāge god vtter ſuch force correcting v reſpecteth infirmitie v wilfull hardhartedneſſe wherethrough wee would withſtand mountaynes high let v looke little vpon hart man ther ſuch trayterouſneſſe v could find hart mount aboue cloudes yea atteyne god throne plucke although wee bee wretched carions yet notwithſtanding ſuche malapertneſſe v wee would controll god work cannot finde harte ſubmit ſelues vntoo ſay well lorde hold thou ſoueraigntie ouer thy creature let none grudge againſt thee put god ſtint euery turne thing faſhion liking fall checking hym agayne hee giue v leaue liſt holde v ſhort • ſay muſt ſo ſtrayte bondage ſeemeth god mynded ſet purpoſe trouble men heere without hauing regard ſtate ſith appoynteth v liue heere bilow ſuffreth v haue leaſtwiſe nature deſireth elſe gaue v another inclination see diueliſh pryde men moreouer v malicious wilfulneſſe ſo god labour bring v backe hee able compaſſe teachable ſide ſo euer turne v booteth wee haue alwayes ſayde ouerſtatelineſſe pride hart although haue played hypocrite little whyle lette man turne hand ſhall finde poyſon hidden vnderneath ſo returne afore vve ſee hardhartedneſſe hath neede bee corrected ſtraunge faſhion thys lorde ſpeaketh ieremie complayneth people vnreformable howbeeit vnder another ſimilitude prophete eſay dooth haue alledged afore compariſon god maketh fitte matter hande god ſayeth people like cake baked one ſide vnbaked example let v put cace man make hote fire harth burning ſparckling well one take cake layes vpon cake baketh ſcorcheth one ſide ſoft paſte ſtill euen ſo v one part nothing frailtie according ſeene men ſay well ynough ala men nothing wretchedneſſe miſerie vve ſpeake truely ſo ſaying howbeit god viſiteth v chaſtizeth v doo wee ſhewe bake vnder correction nay wee rather burne bake ſay god ſhall win one good amendment chaſtizings ſendeth rather fall chafing ſtomaking withall kindle fire wrath vengeance yee ſee whereas god would haue v well baked rather burne lo hee vſeth ſuch violence chaſtizing v let v go complayne god ſhould thunder vpon mountaynes reaſon doing▪ ſee ſhall mend cace vvhat ſhall win pleading ſo ſhall bee next way increace damnation let v aſſure ſelues ſeeing god findeth ſuche wilfull hardhartedneſſe v hee muſte needes ſet ſtrong hande v vſe fauourable meanes good thus ye ſee haue marke thys ſtreyne lette v bee ſure god chaſtizeth v ſtrike boyſtouſly vpon v would vpon mountayne rocke ſame commeth mercie wee ſee greatly requiſite god ſhould vſe ſuch roughneſſe ſay regardeth welfare howſoeuer worlde go ſay euen ſendeth v ſeemeth haue brought v euen vnto hell yet doth hee gyue v wherewith comfort cheere vp ſelues wee muſt thanke fatherly mercie acknowledge wonderfull gracious goodneſſe god vſeth towardes v ſteade iuſt thundering downe vpon v hee ſheweth himſelfe ſo gentle freendly ſeeketh nothing make v feele goodneſſe thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke ſtreyne immediately iob addeth god vttereth force ſo farre hee euen chaungeth countenance frowneth vpon hym hee knoweth heyres ſhall • ee whither poore riche noble v •• oble iob▪ goeth hys complaynte ſheweth god ſhall haue puniſhed men life long▪ theyr ende alſo ſhall bee ſutable therevntoo bee departed worlde ſhall haue intelligence done heere afterwarde addeth concluſion ſo long fleſhe vpon muſt needes payned hys ſoule muſte bee ſorowfull hee hymſelfe muſt mourne surely thys complaynte voyde vnthankfulneſſe iob ought knowe god doth alwayes mingle fauor affliction hee ſendeth v ſo haue cauſe bliſſe hym conſidered vvhy ſo 〈…〉 bycauſe ouerpaſsionate ſorowfull alſo wee muſt beare mynd haue ſayd afore▪ too▪ witte oft god ſcourgeth vs▪ muſt bethynke v benefites wee haue receyued hym help aſſwage greefe wee muze vpon nothing miſerie wee indure wee ſo ouerraught ſorrowe wee bliſſe god call vpon ſettle truſt hym looke way thinke ſelues god hathe done v thus many good turnes hold ſtill ſorrowes aſſwaged therewithall alſo recouer boldneſſe ro call vppon god herevpon conclude behooueth v pacient ynough hath ſhewed himſelfe good father correcting v owne hande bycauſe hee tendereth oure welfare yee ſee thing haue marke firſt place iobs ruſhing ſuche rage bycauſe hee looked miſeries therfore behooueth v bethinke v god benefites afflicteth v ende ſorrow may aſſuaged ſweetned thereby wee doo ſo wee ſhall finde god ſendeth v ſuche griefe neither bodie mynd alwayes matter gladneſſe howe although wee bee ſubiecte manye diſeaſes colde heate ſuche ſufferings yet haue ſhifte approching vnto god power vtter oure infirmity vnto recompence oughte well aſſuage ſorrowes haue cōceyued vve ſee thē wiſe may reſiſt ſuche maner complayntes whiche full vnthankfulneſſe namely thinking vppon benefites haue receyued god hand former time thervpon truſting cōtinue time come verily muſte warned long lyfe laſteth wee muſt bee faine grone fleſhe greeued muſt fayne lamente ende deſire liue eaſe would wiſh god hath told v wil haue v troubled preſente lyfe bothe bodie mynde therefore behoueth v make full rcckening let v marke euen middes ſorrowes wee ſhall haue wherfore praiſe god paule doth calleth himſelf miſerable vvretched man ſayth deliuer mee priſon bodie yeldeth thankes god lorde ieſus chriſte concerning iob ſayeth man departed knoweth done lowe whether ofſpryng poore riche grounde article oure faith vpon ſuche gone world know ſtate iob ſpake man ouercombered therefore wee muſt take certayntie doctrine neither greately v inquire ſuche matter let ſuffize v god hath ſette v worlde communicate one euery man ought imploy himſelf vpon neyghbors god hath giuen ſuche gifte abilitie therefore muſt applie ſelfe waye agayne one v may pray another hath taken v world ſaid cōmunicating taken awaye v communicating neither muſt doe papiſts wont run deceaſſed saincts thoughe yet finiſhed courſes nowe foraſmuche scripture teacheth v wee ought behalfe let v leaue thing doubt ſuſpence whereof wee haue certaine reſolution woorde god ſingleneſſe mynde alſo thing wherin behooueth v walke touching text wee ſee effecte iobs meening nothing elſe man myſerable long lyfe indureth ſayth full payne anguiſhe death extremeſt miſeries bycauſe mā ſeemeth bee vtterly rooted iob ſpake maner bycauſe haue ſayd caryed away paſsions part let v contented languiſh haue fleſhe payned mynde diſtreſſed lyfe yet haue wee whereof reioyce god bycauſe promiſeth alwayes father sauiour doe wee die vvee knowe aduauntage paule ſayeth bicauſe mean god taketh v miſeries world make v partaker rich glorious immortalitie let v knele downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele ſo wee maye craue forgiueneſſe hand may ſo ſtirred vp pray may make v feele goodneſſe mercie wee profit thereby alſo tyme f • ur life may giue ouer ſelues glorifying holy name prayſing hym deſerueth hath broughte v right waye neuer ſuffer v ſwarue aſide may continue inuincible ſtrength ſtedfaſtneſſe euen ende may pleaſe grant grace v c lvij sermon fyrst vpon xv chapter eliphas themanite anſvvered ſayd 2 vvill vviſe man bring foorth knovvledge vvinde fill mennes belly vvith eaſt vvynde 3 vvill reaſon vnmeete matter vnlavvfull vvordes 4 thou pulleſt avvay feare turneſt prayer avvay god 5 thine ovvne mouth ſhall reproue thee vnrightuouſneſſe thou haſte taken toung craftyneſſe 6 thine ovvne mouth ſhall condemne thee thine ovvne lippes beare witneſſe againſt thee 7 art thou firſt man borne vvart thou created mountaynes 8 haſte thou heard ſecretes god vviſedome reſtrained vnto thee 9 vvhat knovveſt thou vve knovve not▪ vvhat vnderſtandeſt thou v 10 vve baldheaded auncient older man among v thy father wee knowe wee haue ſpoken truth god behalfe yet men reiect wee haue ſayd harde greeuous temptation cace onely blamed perſons alſo wee ſee men refuſe thing god neuertheleſſe behoued iob vndertake ſuch battell ſee ſtreyne mainteyned hys cace ſuttletie wilfulneſſe ignorance yet notwithſtanding layd diſh hee taken tung craftineſſe deſpizers god ſayings bin winde wherein bin firmneſſe reaſon iob therefore greeuouſly charged heere maynteyning doctrine knew god muſt ſerue example day many ſo greeued ſee men receyue god word rather moſte part worlde condemneth seeing men haue time bin ſtubborne againſt god hee could neuer yet make receyue theyr behoofe let v thinke ſtraunge wee alſo muſte paſſe ſame way authoritie god hys woord imbaced ſtubborneſſe malice men conſidering iudgemēt ſo awke cannot giue themſelues goodneſſe thoſe haue charge beare god word preach though ſee men reiect yet let ſtand ſtoutly let ſuch doings thruſt way iob condemned ſayings sonne god alſo vvee ſee men ſo farre accepting doctrine riſe vp furiouſly againſt accuſed blaſphemie like done day noueltie meane whyle let v determine god commaundeth v let men aduaunce themſelues much liſt lette reſiſt god truth yet muſt ouerpaſſed muſt ceaſſe duetie marke one poynt way behoueth v marke although wordes whiche rehearſed heere eliphas haue bin miſapplyed perſone iob yet neuertheleſſe generalitie wee may gather good profitable leſſon firſt ſayd wyſe mā wil bring foorth windie word • fill bearer belly eaſterne wind ſame thing ſee commonly scripture▪ wit word ought vnprofitable rather well ſeaſoned with▪ ſalte according sainct paule vſeth ſame ſimilitude afterwarde expreſſe meening ſayeth word ought bee ſubſtantiall meete edifie profit thoſe heare may bee inſtructed feare god guyded aright way incouraged yee ſee vpon ſaying eliphaſsis haue marke word ought tend edification ſo ſhall lyke wynde ſay ſhall bee puffed vp vayne ſwelling ſhal bee ſubſtantialneſſe wherewith feede men ſoules truely • eere ye ſee ſayd good holy doctrine foode taking conuenient foode wee bee ſatisfied gather ſtrength ſtomacke accloyed inſueth good naturall nurriſhment euen ſo wyth word god vvhen well applyed vſe filled wee bee nurriſhed yet meane windineſſe breakes vp vpon ſtomacke brings ſubſtantiall nurriſhmēt see two point haue note firſt men find fauour word wee haue told thing good profitable god muſt therefore pacience conſidering ſame hath happened iob alſo ſeruants god ſo doctrine fauour worldward mocked • taken winde trifling thing contrariwiſe ſide let v well aduiſed ſpeake may edifying neighbour carie ſubſtantiall profite euen oure ordinarie common talke muſt obſerue ſame rule although wee haue ſome libertie yet notwithſtanding god condemneth vanitie v bee giuen prattle vnprofitable matter neuertheleſſe wee ſee men haue hold themſelues nother make mirth except raunge intoo windye word men ſo greatly giuen vntoo that▪ warrant ſay therfore lawful god findeth fault ſee therefore let v hold v doctrine alledged paule talke muſte vnprofitable ſeaſoned ſalt may edifie profite hearer aboue cace ſtandeth vpon handling god woord muſt neerely looked without compariſon cace let v haue regard vſe ſuch ſobrietie wee defile thing god hath ordeyned oure ſaluation certayne ſpeake god woorde dally rayſe vnprofitable queſtions vayne diſputations high treaſon god wherfore lorde hath ſhewed v word ought profit v fall handling • ſuche ſorte apply right lauf • ende play tennisbal paſſe good inſtruction haue oure▪ eares filled wynde ſo ſame ſerueth ſatiſfie▪ mennes vayne curioſitie defiling holye thing • greate wrong diſhonour godward thing ſerueth ſaluation deſpized thruſte vnder foote lette v looke neerely oure ſelues deale holy thing let ſame ſuche reuerence good ſubſtantiall inſtruction may alwayes inſue ſay maye ſo ſettle v ſoules may nouriſhed behooueth v marke well ſimilitude wynde eliphas vſeth heere haue ſayd alreadie doctrine bee good ſuche ſubſtantialneſſe wee ſhall bee fedde wee ſhall fynde good reſte vppon contrarywyſe purpoſe theſe curioſities true good ſtore winde gay ſhewes great likeyhodes yet ende diſappoynte v heere ye ſee sainct paule ſayeth knowledge ſelfe dooth puffe men vp matched loue loue edifieth heare god word owne inſtruction talke inſtruction others wee couet counted skilfull fooliſh vaingloriouſneſſe deſire euery v eſteemed ſharpwitted thought well ſeene ſcriptures elſe wind puffedneſſe sainct paule ſayeth lo diuinitie men haue forged framed themſelues owne vaynegloriouſneſſe like wee ſee papacie men call diuinitie nothing elſe blaſt eaſterne wynde ſeareth thing hath ſubſtance feede nouriſh poore ſoules withall man mighte make generall diſtinction two poynts one parte popiſh diuinitie conſiſteth queſtions quarels bring frute firſt trouble themſelues dayes life cannot finde reſolution mynde ſeeke god neuer diſcloze yea haue hidden ſtill v nowe wee knowe hath ſpoken hee haue oure mouthes kept ſhet eares ſhould itch liſten ſhould wee ſhould bee ignorant teacheth v thus ye ſee true wiſedome deſire know god ſheweth v ſchoole ye ſee alſo popiſh diuines moue queſtions thoſe thing whych god would haue vnknowne vnto v well debate neuer conclude reaſons gueſſes put cace poſsible haue certayne reſolution ſay thus yet ſhall man neuer edified profited beeyng reſolued whiche debate theyr ſchooles diſputing whither bee ſaued god mercie ſhew foraſmuch ſure forgiueneſſe ſinnes wee ought haue ſo muche greater cauſe prayſe magnifye hys goodneſſe towardes vs▪ telling comforte ought take oure aduerſities talke flittering ayre men leaſt good counted greateſt skill thoſe fellowes alone bee contemplatiue ſay ſore aire haue ſteddineſſe thus ye ſee ſhamefull defiling god worde although papacie doctrine wicked fully falſe ſelfe▪ yet neuertheleſſe manner veine haue found bee abhorred meanes haue peruerted true aud naturall vſe god word ſayd afore let v beare well mynde ſuch thing ſerue puffe men vp • eare vp ſoules ſteade feeding gyuing good nouriſhment ſubſtance ought vtterly caſt away ſeconde part popiſh diuinitie ſtabliſh freedome men make beleeue haue ſome power atteyne vntoo good atteyne fully yet bee helper companion god grace hath preuented lift vp themſelues ſuche wiſe owne▪ ſtrength good deſeruings may proceede thereof haue done grace god ſhall fayle ſhoulde ſaye able bind ſide bee able purchace fauour god hande owne workes bee anye default may ſupplye ſatiſfactions papiſts doo thus teach men able themſelues puffing vp preſumption ouerweening mighte aduaunce themſelues againſt god ſooth themſelues owne ſtrength though able worke wonders▪ marke poynt much hurtfull vnprofitable queſtioning touched afore verely bee greatly miſliked yet muche greater harme latter men truſt themſelues flatter themſelues owne ſtrength nexte way ouerthrow quite deadly poyſon ſimple puffing vp alſo diueliſh pride ſerueth ſend wretched ſoules deſtruction meane wee ſee popiſhe diuinitie winde ſerueth puffe vp wretched ſoules giue nouriſhment vvhat bee done let v learne vſe edifying talke ſuche may feede ſeelie ſoules may taught feare god withall know nothing ſelues muſt fayne drawe fountayne vprightneſſe iuſtice god muſt faine make v partaker grace without ſhall voyde goodneſſe vvhen ſuch doctrine ſet foorth ſerue edifie ſhall nouriſhed battled moreouer let v indeuer alſo draw neighbour like nouriſhment ſo wee may fed god truth ſubſtantiall foode muſt edifie v full thus yee ſee haue remember effect concerning thys ſentence ſtreyght another declaration wee ought marke well▪ eliphas ſheweth wherefore hee likeneth fond doctrine blaſting wind thou takest away feare withdraweſt prayer god true ſecond word vſeth ſignifieth ſometimes muzing minding bethinking yet commonly taken prayer ſupplication doubt eliphas ment heere note two principall part edifying wee haue receyue good doctrine marke god ameth ſetteth word afore v hold v awe make v walke feare obedience alſo make v put whole truſt hym call vppon ſeeing wee bee deſtitute ſpirite wiſedome rightuouſneſſe power life marke twoo poyntes wee haue obſerue wee intende ſhoote right marke come point whyche god calleth v vntoo true wee ſhall heare many thing god woorde handled afore v haue ſayde commeth thoſe two poyntes eliphas therefore intending conclude iobs learning winde puffeth vp ſwelleth ſtomacke ſayeth taketh away feare withdraweth prayer god ſhould ſay turned aſide feare god minded call vpon flee vnto goodneſſe winde make v burſt nouriſh v may better ſee edification ſpeaketh oftentimes ſayd paul al muſt done edifying edifying ſhould taught feare god ſtabliſhed ſame ſecondly ſhould bee taught call vppon warned ſeeke welfare alone according alſo place ſhall find touching feare importeth much life muſt bee ruled according wil god becommeth men whē knowe themſelues bee ſubiect theyr maker ruſh naughtineſſe vve know luſtes feare god reigne v muſt acknowledge hath put v worlde liue ſuch libertie liſt ſelues reſerueth hys whole right ouer v ſo muſt obey hym behold ſay word teare importeth ſay ſhould learne direct whole life god vve haue law whereby guideth v ſheweth v diſcerne betweene good euill excepte wee bee vtterly confounded wee muſt begin poynt yet v feare god ſaue gouernance holy ſpirit voyde goodneſſe giuen nothing euil lay god law lyues men ſhall find deadly battell betwixt betweene fire water yea euen whole nature thyng contrarye god rightuouſneſſe affection fleſh sainct paule ſayeth eyght romanes enimyes vntoo god seeyng cace ſo muſt come praying forſomuch wee drawe wholly vntoo euill yea wholly carried awaye rapted vntoo furie wee muſte beſeeche god lay hande vppon v guide v make hys holye ſpirite rule ouer v ſuche wyſe wee may freely ſingle hart ſticke vntoo hys rightuouſneſſe vntoo euer hee calleth v vnto alſo hee ſuffer temptation satan vvorlde turne v dooing good may pleaſe hym forgyue v oure faultes bee alwayes mercifull louing towardes v thus ye ſee prayer ought bee ioyned feare god ynough v ſhewed ought god requireth hand duetie muſt alſo bee incouraged go haue whole recourſe vnto hym ſeeke thing wanteth ſelues ende may releeue neede remedie ſame cheefe phiſition haue well borne away text wee ſhall haue profited greatly one day vve come oftentimes ſermons vve wander bring theſe two point gyue diligent hearing wherfore come thither know god requireth oure hāds ought walke beaſts world god alloweth none rule men ſhould obey frame themſelues according hys deuotions men deuiſe ſtarke folie according wee ſee howe wretched papiſts torment themſelues ſore ſo end one thing gaine doings theyr owne deuices lawe god good buried among let v beware beguile ſelues let comming vnto sermon atteine certeintie wherein may fayle vvhiche thing come paſſe admit nothing el god wil rule gouerne whole life howbeit haue purpoſe men beate eares preaching ſay behold thus muſte yee behold thus doth god commaund vntill ſuch time haue learned printeth lawe hart ingraueth bowel giueth v power ſticke hys commaundements holy ſpirite giueth force effectualneſſe doctrine goodneſſe accepteth v forgiueth v ſinnes ſay purpoſe till haue learned thoſe thing bene taught reſort vnto demaund hande whatſoeuer wee haue neede ynough v haue told v thus thus muſt ye ſayd god muſt fayne giue v ſtrength performe ſhall craue hand furthermore wee bee admoniſhed faith edified aduerſitie always ingendreth v deſire prayſe god reſort vnto vvhen tolde v lorde ieſus chriſte hath reconciled v god father ſhed bloud waſh v wee might pure cleane hath payde price raunſome wee might quit rightuouſneſſe ſo become acceptable god vſe mercie towardes v knowing theſe thing ſay end ſhould throughly cleaue vnto ſay well may bee ſaued meere grace god aſmuch lord ieſus chriſt hath made ſatisfaction v end faith ſhoulde reſt therevpon muſt therfore lie ſtill aſleepe muſt awake may repaire vnto god ſay welfare death paſsion lorde ieſus chriſte therefore muſt ſeeke ſhall finde among men muſt wee ſeeke prayer ſupplications let v come vnto god ſay lord ſith thou ſeeſt v voyde goodneſſe fill thou v thy grace true wretched ſinners howbeit aſmuch wee bee member thy sonnes body wee ſhall bee made rightuous hym true full ſpottes hee hath wherewith clenze v hee hath good waſhing v true wee bee giltie euerlaſting death bound therevntoo lorde ieſus chriſt hath ſet v free vvherefore lorde bee ſo good v make v partaker thing purchaced v thine infinite goodneſſe beholde manner ought haue recourſe vnto god lette v ſay yea lorde fill thou v thy holy ſpirite hee may leade v ſtrength ſuffer v faynt temptation befall v thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke thys ſtreyne eliphas doth afterwarde vpbrayd iob hath chozen tung craftineſſe preſent ſaying importeth hee doth mocke god whiche bereft feare reuerence haue reaſon ſometimes men ſhall ſinne ſimplicitie yet ſtande ſome feare god howbeit ſhall dulled time according wee ſhall ſee many touched liuely ſorte little better brute beaſtes yet notwithſtanding ſhall ſome feare god lie hidden whych good choked wel ſuch manner folke haue ſimplicitie craftineſſe malice otherſome thinke themſelues ſharpwitted ſcoffe religion dally god maieſtie take vnmeaſurable libertie follow euill ſet purpoſe ye ſee craftie ſuttle folke whome eliphas maketh mention thys ſtreyne ſuch amiſſe ignorance ouerſight ſuche wilfully ſet purpoſe make none account god handling hys woord contemptuouſly make ſport ſtage play behold toppe iniquitie lette v marke well god let men runne ſo farre vpon brydle ſhew themſelues ſuttlewitted againſt hym hath satan taken ſuche poſſeſsion right harde bring backe againe right way yea manner impoſsible wee ſee alſo wiſe prophet eſay thundereth againſt ſuche kinde folke ſaying curſed make lurkingholes vſeth ſimilitude inſpeaking theſe ſuttleheaded folke beare themſelues hand beguile god vvhen haue ſharpened wittes inuented fine ſlightes beholde ſtrayning themſelues aboliſh feare god mark wherat begin ſo bridled ſay one word ſcripture thing muſt yeeld vnto without gayneſaying thing many thing vnderſtoode againe man may doubt thing v compelled yeeld ſuche authoritie god word may lawfull v aske cace ſtandeth theſe politike head therefore ſo deſirous worke wyles god begin poynte namely taking leaue keepe men ſeeing thing men call god word end mouthes ſhould tungtied mē might raze quite cleane whē entred doubt afterwarde harden themſelues good reaſon god ſhoulde leaue satan ſhould cary headlong bee come poynt nothing elſe bleare tung againſt al doctrine greefe remorſe conſcience ſhort bee bereft humanitie become brutiſh thus yee ſee ſayde impoſsible thoſe whome god hath left poynt ſhould euer returne way ſaluation therefore let v beware hold oure ſelues ſtreytly ſubiection vnto god beare ſuche reuerence worde wee may ſhunne vtterly abhorre deteſt ſlightes ſuttleties wherein wicked ſort delight welter themſelues think themſelues ſharpwitted ynough till haue deſpized god alſo theſe fantaſtical fleeing heades ſeene thinke themſelues dullard eſtimation till haue learned mocke god rid themſelues quite religion ſo hearken ſay behold god ſpeaketh obeyed vve ſee many dayes thinke ouergreat ſimpleneſſe ſubmit man ſelfe ſo willingly vnto god meane ſhake feare god ſuch confuzion come therefore behoueth v ware ſet muche ſtore ſimplicitie god requireth v verely minde haue v dulheaded fayth papiſtes imagine namely men ſhoulde go lyke goſ • ings vvhen papiſtes ſay men muſt lyue ſimply ſimplicitie meane men ſhoulde diſcerne betweene white blacke know ought holde follow god ſayd wil haue v ſo ignorant muſt bee child lewdneſſe vnderſtanding sainct peter ſayth wee muſt learne god fetch light brightneſſe holy ſpirite worde liue lewdly deſire fed foode ſimplicitie vprightneſſe milke like god handled child manner olde time ſo haue ſame foode ſet v day alſo way haue note god ſeruants muſt bee ready armed agaynſt ſuche ſtumbling blockes men caſt teeth deſpize god theyr whole drift bring confuzion adayes papiſtes ſo ſhameleſſe vpbrayde v wee ſeeke nothing bring men fleſhly libertie might honeſtie among men anye man paſſe ſerue god exerciſe himſelfe brotherly charitie vvell layd charge charge alone vve ſee iob aſſayled wyth lyke temptation therefore let v beare ſuch pacience may ſhew god worlde men v wrong charging v wyth euill well may wee anſwer ſo haue eye frame ſelues god ſheweth giue attentiue eare ſayth v furthermore wee chalenge knowledge thing haue learned ſchoole may continue ſame onely worde ynough beate backe ſlaunders enimies truth lay vpon v herewithal let v turne men away truſt themſelues whereas commaunded ſerue god purely end ſhould put whole truſt ſhould vnderſtande howe wee ought whatſoeuer ſeemeth good ſelues turne aſide eyther right hande left ſimply reſpects folow whatſoeuer god commaundeth v ye ſee ought pure afore god alſo haue good report among men walke aright wicked folke ſlaunder v muſt beare paciently yet knowe bee impudent ſhameleſſe eliphas hauing ſpoken ſo addeth iob ought truſt ſo much wit art thou first man ſayth wart thou borne mountaynes heere auncient gray healed men yea euen ſuch elder thy father art thou counſell god vvhen eliphas vpbraydeth iob faſhion old ynough ought take vpon ſuch libertie iudging verely hath ſome colour ſaying haue ſene afore god ſo gracious vnto man let liue long time heere may well haue learned many thing againe knowe men wit better ſettled age yong men caſt foorthe manye bubble age repreſſeth bee preſumed old man foraſmuch hath profited liuing long world ought perfecter haue certayne skill men yet thys ſee ſtead profiting long life moſt part go backward men might oftentimes theyr age atteine good knowledge vnderſtanding yea vnto ſome wiſedome howbeit foraſmuch naturally go euill worſe god vphold v therefore ſeene moſt part men become fooles age youth marke one poynt againe alſo truſting owne agedneſſe reſpect god wiſedome hee dealeth foorth pleaſeth yong old according ſayeth prophet ioell beholde dayes ſhall come poure ſpirit vpon fleſh olde men ſayeth hee ſhall dreame dreames ſay ſhall bee prophet teach ſonnes daughter ſhall ſee viſions place ſee god calleth well yong olde well woman men receyuing wiſedome ſendeth worlde ſo muſt glory age throwne downe old folke haue liued neuer ſo long haue neuer ſo much experience▪ behoueth know yet foloweth muſt needes know ſecretes kingdome heauen hand god men muſt preſume know reaſon long time true god call v childhood ought confirmed age thing bringeth working god grace euery whit proceedeth therefore haue cauſe ſtande owne conceyte brag thing hand heerein ſee dotage papiſts ground al foundation faith vpon antiquitie ſaying see ſirs doctrine new ſtart vp yeſterday yeare twain ago world hath liued ſo long time wee bee poſſeſsiō purpoſe afore god cace ſtandeth vpon hauing euerlaſting truth whiche hath bene making world ſo muſt go god lord ieſus chriſt haue ſure reſting ſtocke faith leane vnto matter concerneth ſcore yeeres foure hundred thouſand wee muſte haue euerlaſting truth hath bin diſclozed v making world wee haue oure fayth ſhall well ſettled want vanitie wee ſhall alwayes bee mammering needeth one little▪ blaſt wind behold faith quite blowne downe let v beare mind antiquitie muſte beare ſuche ſway v yong folke may vtterly refuſe ruled ſuch elder ſpecially go turne whyche haue learned concerning one god truth lo wee haue marke heere withall thoſe haue liued long time world let glory age ſay ought take folkes trip rather knowe ſo muche▪ bound vnto god giuing meanes occaſiōs ſettled ſtayed▪ furthermore let father wiſedome vpon god ſo pride caſt downe imagine themſelues haue gotten knowledge eyther length tyme fineneſſe witte owne forecaſt great experience thing el then▪ bycauſe hath pleaſed god poure ſpirit vpon v might know greatly wee beholden vntoo let yong men alſo ſide knowe god haue giuen gift grace bycauſe leaue deſtitute ſpirite old folke ſuch haue liued long time intē deth ſhew making v partaker ſelfeſame grace ſpirite alſo make v heyres heauenly kingdome come euerlaſting glory hath reuealed vnto v already part let v kneele downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym make v ſo feele may flee alone partie able remedie harmes ſeeke ſuch wiſe wee may bee hilde priſoners vnder obedience deſire thing ſticke purely ſimply word renouncing ſoeuer owne nature bycauſe nothing corruption frowardneſſe alſo praying renew v ſuch wiſe holy ſpirite likeſhapen image may haue ſo much better certentie proofe taketh v child alſo may yeelde thanks agayne father may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people c lviij sermon ſecond vpon xv chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon viij ix x verſes vpon followeth 11 seeme god comfortes ſmall thing vnto thee ſtraunge vntoo thee 12 vvhy thy hart rauiſhed vvhy thyne eye make ſigne 13 thou buckleſt thy ſelfe againſt god vttereſt vvordes thy mouth hym 14 vvhat man hee ſhould bee cleane borne vvoman ſhoulde rightuouſe 15 behold findeth ſtedfaſtneſſe saincts nother heauens cleane ſight 16 hovv much man abhominable filthie vvho drinketh iniquitie vvater ſawe yeſterday reproche offered vnto iob reſpect age therevpon ſaide good reaſon yong folke ſhould ruled counſell elder giue eare ſuche haue experience reaſon lōg vſe alſo foraſmuch god hath giuen old men grace liue long ought conſider bound teach others ſhew way yet yong old ought knowe true wiſdome god giueth aboue god dealeth foorth ſame ſuch wiſe thinketh good men muſt imagine bounde vnto hath promiſed poure ſpirit vpon greate ſmall liſteth end may knowen bee free gift praiſe ought giuen alone heere agayne eliphas vpbraydeth iob hath heard god ſecretes poynteth men generall behoueth v vnderſtande rudeneſſe weakeneſſe owne witte true meane reuerence god ſecrets knowing incomprehenſible high v attaine vnto long men preſume vpon owne wit thinke atteyne heighth god ſecrets certayne cannot humbled brought anye modeſtie ye ſee poynt whereto muſt come muſt reuerence honour god ſecrets ſeeing haue capacitie cōprehend ſo much haue acknowledge infirmitie crie euery one dauid lorde high thy determination ought reuerence yee ſee effect eliphas ment ſaying vnto iob heard ſecrets god doctrine often repeted common holy ſcripture bycauſe hard abate pride naturally rooted men onely euery one v take vpon bee wiſer hys fellowe alſo cannot finde hart acknowledge oure owne ſlenderneſſe humble ſelues euen come god therefore haue neede brought low warned scripture doth muſt go comprehend purpoſe god high profound thing v vvhat remayneth honour acknowledging owne rawneſſe weakeneſſe ſayd afore way wee muſte come whiche sainct paule ſayeth firſt corinthian wit sauiour hath giuen v owne ſpirit whereby know comprehend aboue capacitie although counſell god yet hath ſhewed v fauour honour diſcloſe vnto v vnknowne hidden v none knoweth man ſpirit whiche dwelleth ſayeth paule ſpirit dwelleth god giuen vnto v thus ye ſee made partaker thing vtterly ſeparated v wherevnto wee cannot anye meanes approch marke heere ſingular grace whych ought make great account namely lorde hath inlightened v euen v wretched blynde ſoules although comprehend thing heere bylow yet wee lifted vp aboue heauens thing reueled knowne v whiche angells wonder see ye ineſtimable honoure howbeit sainct paule ſayeth done god giuing ſpirite v hee excludeth hys word god intendeth diſcloſe ſecretes ſendeth v inſpirations alſo ſpeaketh vntoo v neuertheleſſe without cauſe paule imputeth thing ſpirit may well reade heare ſhall profit awhit except god open minde wee may vnderſtande hee telleth v word mouth therefore wee muſt match ſpirit word togither ſay muſt beleeue lord hath layd foorth treaſures infinite wiſedome vnto v giuing v law teaching v hys prophetes ſpecially goſpell ſide let v alſo conſider opening oure eye intent thing conteyned holy scripture ſhould ſtrange language v intent wee ſhoulde acquaynt ourſelues therewith owne wit ſhould neuer atteine wee ſee men muſt humble themſelues knowing well god counſell therfore ought honour ſecretes furthermore foraſmuch hath pleaſed god make v priuie hys let v conceyue hys meening according hee ſheweth vnto v yet muſt ouerwiſe god giueth v ſpirite ſhewe v thing hidden v paſſe reach mās reaſon ende ſhould know muſt hold ourſelues contented knowe part yet ſayeth sainct paule therefore let v beware paſſe boundes let v diſcreetly ſeeke god would haue v know ſhall finde holy ſcripture let v go furthermore although vnderſtand tenth part thing holy ſcripture let v pray god diſcouer dayly thing whiche hidden v yet therewithall let v walke vnder ſubiection raſh runne farre behoueth euen forwardeſt perfecteſt men vnderſtand yet know • ſecretes god reſerued til latter day ſurely without cauſe dauid though ſo excellent prophet crieth god determination wonderfull thing heereby ſheweth v impoſsible v atteyne perfection ſuch vnderſtanding vntill god haue bereft v mortall fleſh ſo let v aſſure ourſelues long wee worlde wee way thus yee ſee wee haue remember ſtreyne nowe eliphas addeth weenest thou god comfortings ſmall thing ſecrete thee ſtrange thee woorde secrete betokeneth ſtraunge eliphas meeneth heere reproue iob pride vnthankefulneſſe hee ſayth howe nowe ſeemeth thou deſpiſeſt conſolations god thou thinkeſt ſtraunge ſhould comfort thee man point ſurely ouer great pryde yea deſpyzing god grace whych bee borne withall ought eſteeme god comfortings aboue thing troubled ſhifte remedie v except god bring v backe againe right way let v marke well combered perplexitie bee oure wit ende matter wee diſpatch ſelues nother ſhifte v god pacifie v content v ſuch meane muſt make great account aboue thing whē bee greateſt trouble whole worlde god well inlighten wittes bring v quietneſſe neede god ſhould ſhew ſelfe rid trouble heauen earth ſhould ye would ſay confoūded togither ſo ther nothing confuſion ouer yet pleaſe god appeare vnto v hee ſet thing order againe ſuch ſort thing greatly intangled could ſhall become cleere ſo wee ſhall ſee nothing trouble vexe v lo cauſe haue commend god comfortings conſiſteth deede worde flee god refuge maye well perceiue howe great force comfortes bee ſtrength haue appeaze v wee haue leaſte comberance world behold vexation diſtreſſe according knowe men giuen vnquietneſſe ſoone haue neuer ſo light occaſion greefe ſeemeth ſelues kindle fire torment ſelues withall vttermoſt see pray ſtate men ſo long god leaueth ſleepe ſuch trouble perceiue dayly howe god bringeth v backe verely ſeemeth oure ſelues ſhall neuer ſcape ſome perplexitie therefore aſtoniſhed ſay ala ſhall become vvee bee drowned ſo deepe wee thinke ſhall neuer able get ſuch confuſion yet notwithſtanding god ſetteth ſuche order wee bee vtterly abaſſhed mynds quiet appeazed vvhereof commeth ſuch alteration bycauſe god worketh ſo mightily heartes ende ſhould magnifie comfortes exceedingly although wee bee conuinced experience none onely god comfort v perplexity anguiſh pleaſeth ſo doe wee haue well wherewith content ſelues yet notwithſtanding forget turning hande▪ greefe befall v none v hee feedeth humour chafing vpon brydle talke repayring vnto god ſay howe nowe beholde thy god hath ſhewed thee heretofore thou muſt repaire yet notwithſtanding thou thinkeſt much muſt marke well ſentence wit men make account god comforte bee deliuered thereby anguiſhe perplexitie trouble mynde bee vnthankfull beſides vnthankfulneſſe haue alſo ſhamefull pryde perceyue owne neceſsitie might ſeeke remedie pryde expreſſed yet better worde secrete eliphas ſayth ſecrete thee ſhould ſay wretched creature feeleſt thou thyne owne frayltie ſurely men knewe themſelues bee deede ſhould needes fall agreement god bee inflamed ſuche deſire thereof would neuer bee reſt vntill god made feele grace wee bee ſo blockiſhe weene oure ſelues bee wiſe whereas nothing fooliſhneſſe vanitie v vve thinke ſelues haue remedie miſerie ſleeues wee happen combred trouble fall ſharpning wit muſt need deuiſing ſome ſhift would ſay al matter could forged owne ſhop yet men ſo ouerweening therefore ſayde heere ſecrete thee perceyued groſſe ignorant doltiſhe ſurely would ſuche fooles ſurmiſe wee haue wherewith deliuer ſelues anguiſh trouble would goe ſtreyght wayes vnto god beeing well aſſured onely ſet thing ſtay according perceiue verie deede himſelfe ſheweth well ynough thus much therefore concerning ſentence according haue ſayde alreadie let v put ſame vre much life ſubiect ſo many miſeries impoſsible man ſhould haue one minute reſt himſelfe without carrying away without forgetting himſelfe let v go god may comfort v let v make account warning giueth v deſerue god comforteth v diuers wayes haue ſayde alreadie declareth trouble whereout ſeemed ſhould neuer get diſpatcheth ſuch wiſe perceiue hee hathe deliuered v nowe let v come eliphas addeth hee ſayth iobs heart caried away hee maketh ſigne eye lifte vp himſelfe god eliphas reproueth iobs pride wrongfully without cauſe according haue ſayde alreadie although matter miſapplyed iob himſelfe yet may wee gather profitable leſſon ſuch one ſerueth turnes therfore ſayth howe thy hart rauiſhed hath ſurpriſed thee worde worde thus howe bathe thy heart ſeazed thee howe thou makeſt countenance thine eye pleade againſt god make ſigne countenance eye bee ſo ſcornefull nothing elſe leere men ſay turne away eares men tell v thing wee knowe men doe ſo regarde thing ſpoken take ſuperfluous matter nothing could alledged knowen afore ſhort ſee eliphas ment condemne ſuche pryde iob though hee humbled himſelfe vnto god hearken ſayde vnto heerewithall ſheweth ſuch pride yll grounded ſayth iobs heart rauiſhed certeine pryde alwayes one vice men therefore much lord ſeeth men ſtand ſo owne conceit wexe hard pryde hee fayne ſhewe fooles vtterly witleſſe preſuming ſo muche themſelues beating themſelues hande haue whereof vaunt haue apparance likelyhoode abilitie yee ſhall ſee v lifted vp ſo high hold v wee ſtye ſo farre till wee ready breake necke lord perceyuing v ſo wholy giuen puffed vp preſumption asketh v yee vvhat haue yee open ſhop let men ſee men ſhould come ſuche tryall would ſoone perceiued nothing foliſh weening euer imagined thus ye ſee haue gather vpon text ſayde men open mouth againſt god pretend vaunt themſelues humble themſelues becōmeth ſame proceedeth frentikeneſſe well ſetled wittes neuer ſo little knowledge diſcretion certayne would humbled goe withſtand god ſorte preſume vpon thing themſelues conſidering haue thing condemnation muſt fayne abide confounded owne ſhame behold heere excellent ſentence haue skill apply well oure owne inſtruction vvhat bee done let v learne knowe oure ſelues according olde prouerbe ſhall humbed ſo ſhall vaunt ourſelues men refreyne ſtart boundes cauſe runne ſo head wee doe yea euen caſting ſelues ſuche ouerweening god fayne fall vpon v enemie proud hard v rauiſhed caried away ſtand vpon ſelues cauſeth mē ſo blind haue vertue vprightneſſe wiſedome bycauſe pryſoners themſelues ſay bycauſe bleare yees blinde themſelues wilfully guide himſelfe marke god commaundeth ſhall fynd ynough humble himſelfe withall ſtop owne eye wilfully wee needes bee deceyued wittingly men carie themſelues away ſorte muſt needes giue god ſlip regarde thing ſheweth rather make mocke tolde end muſt fall confuſion let v come principall poynt hitherto eliphas hath vſed preface ſhewe nothing hindered iob make owne profite warning hee heard puffed vp pryde vnthankefull vnto god nowe hee addeth man hee ſhould bee able iustifye himſelfe god ſhould bee found pure cleane god findeth ſtedfastneſſe saint ſay angel nother heauens cleane ſight ſhall become ſtinking abbominable corrupt man drinketh inquitie water like fiſhe fed water ſo • n ſoked ſinne wickedneſſe ſhall take hande iuſtifie themſelues god firſt formoſt neede cleaner purer angelles neede ſurmoung brightneſſe sunne starres ſeeing heauens themſelues infected▪ god compariſon ſhould made betwene hath bene treated part already heeretofore howbeit repeated without cauſe ſo haue wee neede call mynde thing haue bene fayde afore notable leſſon ſuch one minded often firſt behoueth v knowe ſorte angel haue ſtedfaſtneſſe god haue expounded diuels reaſon ſo thing ſay diuels rightuous therefore muſt men take vpon ſo vve knowe diuell prince iniquitie naughtineſſe expreſſe mention made angel ye ſee howe place termed saint holy one god according alſo holie scripture yeeldeth ſame title oftentimes calleth elect chozen angel let v conſider ſort god findeth ſtedfaſtneſſe onely bycauſe ſhould haue conſtancie cotinue goodneſſe vnleſſe god preſerued thē power▪ bycauſe verie truth haue ſo ſound exquiſite rightuouſneſſe might reſt themſelues vpon ſame commeth poynt preſenting themſelues afore god render account point ſay ſhall found angel howe ſo ſee haue none deſire obey god nother ſubiect euill luſtes wee bee temptation thruſt way deſire god ſhould bee doone earth heauen wee meene thereby obedience angel yelde vnto god without impeachment vnperfecte feeble thing deſire doe good go limpingly tenth parte ſo giuen ſeruing god requiſite howe doe vnderſtande god findeth ſtedfaſtneſſe angel ſay able anſwere haue tolde afore iudging v god vſeth meaſure hath ſet law wit loue heart mynd ſtrength thus yee ſee meane rightuouſneſſe wherewith god contenteth himſelf cace concerneth iudging angel men euē according rightuouſneſſe faultie boaſt yelding vp whole affection vnto god haue bene drawne away ſome wicked luſt ala ſo farre atteyning poynt much bee way thitherward yee ſee men condemned god euen reſpect mean rightuouſneſſe yee ſee alſo sainte paule alledgeth ſentence curſed hee fulfilleth thinges conteyned law ſaith ſentence condemneth v angelles acceptable god reſpect rightuouſneſſe bycauſe blemiſhe ſpotte deſires ſet wholly ſeruing honoring god ſo giue themſelues nothing elſe ſo according rightuouſneſſe law god accepteth thē ſaid afore another higher rightuouſneſſe god ſurmounteth creature ſo muche angell able ſatiſfie wonder compariſon betweene infinite thing thing hath boundes behold although angel haue great glory yet creature god infinit thing ſo much thinke vpon wee ought rauiſhed aſtoniſhment let v thinke ſtrange god rightuouſneſſe ſhould ſo high creature come poynt bee found ſhall nothing ſhall deſerue vtterly wiped therefore ſaide god findeth ſtedfaſtneſſe angel ſay hee liſted vſe ſayd extreme examination towarde angelles muſt needes vaniſhe away muſt needes bee caſt downe ſunken howbeit much god contented bee honored ſerued according rule hee hath giuen v lawe ſtand face hee auoweth ryghtuouſe deede tryed ſo bee theſe two diuers thinges namely god hath ryghtuouſneſſe hath meaſured capacitie yet commeth ſuch rigour ſay hee hath atteyned ſee come god ſhall condemned accurſed ſo farre vnable ſtande vpright angel heauen confounded bycauſe verie heauens ſelues cleane whereas god hath created ſunne giue light worlde giuen ſome brightneſſe starres alſo followeth therefore haue diuine perfection vve muſt remember hath bene ſayd afore namely creature god made keepe ſtill ſome markes grace man woulde compare creature god hee ſhall fynde one nothing thus yee ſee howe heauens cleane ſaye alwayes ſome imperfection creature ſo haue power ſtand god reſpect infinite glorie ſayde ſeeing cace ſuch ſhall become men haue touched alreadie namely although god would examine v mean rightuouſneſſe hath ſet forth lawe yet ſhould v found giltie vniuerſall damnation ſhould lie vpon mankind vnder lie ouerthrowne ſhort behold howe men confuted two wayes come god head vpright goe iuſtifie ſelues confuſion muſt needes appeere ſo muche ſhall rightuouſer angel heauen ſee creature able holde commeth creator creator muſt need ſwallow vp glorie make thing vaniſh ſeemed aught worth yea ſeemeth wonderfull according ſayd sunne ſhall giue light moone ſhall bee darkned bycauſe glorie god ſhall ſhine farre brighter prophet eſayes intent doe v witte whenſoeuer god ſpeaketh forth glorie euer creature muſt vaniſh away though hath bene neuer ſo highly eſteemed afore▪ sunne ſenſleſſe creature doe darken light starres day long ſo although abyde ſtill skie yet ſeene whyle sunne ſhineth ſhall maieſtie god doe creature able approch neere vnto one creature excell another ſhall god himſelfe doe thus ye ſee confuted one wiſe preſume vpō rightuouſneſſe come god fooliſh ouerweening thinking god ought bee bounde vnto v wee able bring worthineſſe vnto though rightuouſer angelles heauen purer cleaner verye heauens yet nothing ſurmiſe ſelues haue marke one poynt howe bee let v goe perfect rightuouſneſſe let v come onely meane rightuouſneſſe god hath ſet vnto v let v looke may creature requireth nothing wee ſhould loue heart al mynd al ſtrength man ſay reaſonable yet vvhervnto giue mynds ſet wholly vpō god ſo loozened earthly bandes may lift themſelues vp heauen doe wee lead heere ſprituall life forſaking thing may turne v away god meete ſhould ſo matter ſtande onely vpon praying vnto god let v take example scripture ſheweth v man commeth praye vnto god hee muſt retire himſelfe diſcharge mynd caces paſsions like thing may hinder ſo wee muſt vtterly ouerthrowne feeling owne wretchedneſſe wee may ſeeke helpe god hande lo howe prayer thing greater prerogatiue reſt life yet come praying ſee ourſelues ſo fleſhly wee haue eye many wicked fancy wee quite cleane leaue although haue ſome good mind praying yet miſſe drawn ſtil diuers way seing ſo fugitiue ſo holy thing prayer wil reſt whole life deed euery one v ought perceiue well ynough foule ſhame muſt told theſe thing men know thē throughly thēſelues sith cace ſtandeth ſo ala able ſtand god ſhall ſtand nowe vpon iuſtifying rightuouſneſſe true iob went ſuche thing eliphas wrong iniurie accuſing pride way muſt profit ourſelues leſſon conſider aduiſedly ſayd men charged frailtie papiſtes ſelues eaſily confeſſe weake therefore ſufficiente ryghtuouſneſſe v ſatiſfye god wee bee led heere witte men altogither ſaped ſinne demaunded ſentence howe men iuſtifye themſelues ſith able fulfill lawe bewrapped many imperfection loden ſo many infirmity ſo inconſtant fleeting ſuche termes whiche might ſpoken againſt men without comming poynt ſayd men cannot iuſtify themſelues bycauſe abhominable filthy drinke iniquitie water ſay proper nurriſhment ſinne ſo muche one droppe goodneſſe founde ſhort lyke body draweth ſuſtenance meate drinke ſo alſo men haue none ſtuffe ſinne corrupted verie ſubſtance men terme oure bodyes ſoules euill thing wee bee god workmanſhip cace ſpeake groſſely expreſſe euer v attaynted euill verely bodyes good creature god ſo likewiſe ſoules peruerted whereas god created ſoules good notwithſtanding infected euill one droppe goodneſſe ſtained vtterly imbaced thus yee ſee effect ſhewed v firſt wee haue note great difference betwixt weakneſſe corruption ſayd men weake papiſts prattle heathen men haue ſayd full much hee ſayth ſo paynim haue ſayde men inconſtant hard thing followe vertue inclined vice paynim ſay knewe well inough papiſtes themſelues confeſſe daye yet knowe truth ſo much one droppe goodneſſe men abhominable god vntill hee haue reclaymed grace howe ende men ſhould preſume vpon thing themſelues holie ghoſt calleth abhominable ſtinking fylthy noughtworth behold alſo howe ſayde pſalme god looked downe heauen ſee one rightuous man hee founde one gone way become abhominable ſtinking true ſtead ſtinking ſome haue tranſlated vnprofitable meaning wee bee withered away nothing left vs▪ thing vtterly corrupted ſayd expreſly pſalme god knewe men ſo bycauſe men would alwayes bee owne iudges purpoſe forſooth wee wold haue god tied fancy bicauſe think ſelues men ſufficient abilitie would god ſhould content himſelfe oure opinion contrarie part ſayde let men iuſtifie themſelues liſte let euerye man cratch fellowes itch let ſooth one another naughtineſſe lette playe drunken ſottes yet ſhall god leaue hys looking downe heauen ſhall fynde ſtinch lothlineſſe vve lothſome god yet meane thinke ourſelues haue maruellous ſtuffe v gayne oft tempted pride ſtatelineſſe thinke wee haue apparance vertue v let come oure mynde ſummon ſelues god let v bethinke v dreadfull ſaying god hath looked downe hee hath
