examined men throughly one euen one hut hee infected ſtinking lothely ſight thus ye ſee ſentence vnderſtood whereas ſayde wee drinke iniquitie water ſerueth yet better expreſſe whole life giuen euill fiſh feedeth vpon water ſo men doe nothing elſe feede vpon ſinne verely wee ought blame god euill v adam created corruption ſpoken purchaced himſelf god found thing good made man therefore excellenteſt creature marred faſhion till withdrawne ſelfe god ſeparated himſelf fountaine rightuouſneſſe could remain vnto naughtineſſe corruption thus ſee whence naughtineſſe proceedeth ought blame god vice wherevnto ſubiect vnder hild priſoners according scripture ſayth wee ſold vnder ſinne become bondſlaues satan vve muſt blame god wee muſt learne knowe heritage haue father adam therefore muſt take whole blame ourſelues god lo wiſe muſt vnderſtand corruption bondage ſinne ſpoken make ſerue excuſe ſay ala withall wee ſee thoſe doe blaſpheme god ſay ſeeing men ſo giuen euill haue power withſtande temptation ought acquit god condemne therevpon hee cruell yee ſhall ſee men blaſpheme ſort therefore let v keepe oure mouthes ſhut aſſuring oure ſelues euill reſteth ſelues wee vtterly ſoked wickedneſſe wee bee iuſtifyed god houeth v yeeld ourſelues giltie owne accorde otherwiſe ſayd one fyfteth pſalme muſte euermore bee accomplyſhed namely god ſhall alwayes bee founde ryghtuous iudging thoughe wee fall checking againſt yet ſhall continue alwayes rightuous yea euen confuſion deſirous iuſtified god one onely meane doe come confeſſe nothing horrible confuſion v haue ſo much one drop goodneſſe therefore let v deſire god receiue v mercie make v rightuous lord ieſus chriſtes ſake ſay waſh away filthyneſſe bloude sonne impute rightuouſneſſe vnto v truth wee clothed garmentes wee ſhall acceptable good god bycauſe ſhall haue perfect angelicall rightuouſneſſe v let v fall preſence good god acknowledgement oure ſaultes praying reach v hande wee may continue trouble ſhame although haue walke many temptation yet wee may bee deſtitute hys ayde ſuccor comforting ſtrengthening v wee maye ſo get victorie incounters may haue cauſe yeld thankes according working v wee may ſtabliſhed time come euen till wee haue obteyned full victorie come glorie heauen ſhall triumphe lord ieſus chriſt may pleaſe graunt grace c lix sermon third vpon fiftenth chapter 17 vvill tell thee heare haue ſeene vvill declare vnto thee 18 vvhat vviſe men haue told receiued father haue concealed 19 vvhom alone land vvas giuen ſtranger paſſed 20 vvicked alvvayes vvere trauell childe number yeres hid outrageous 21 noiſe feare eares vvhen peace behold deſtroyer ſhal come vpon 22 beleeueth get darkneſſe ſhall ſee ſvvorde yeſterday ſawe plight man hee god fauour wit ther nothing confuſion filthineſſe ſo farre hee beeing able haue anye rightuouſneſſe maye ſtande god nowe meane haue conſider god great goodneſſe towardes v clothing v rightuouſneſſe ſurmounteth ryghtuouſneſſe aungels vvee bee wretched miſerable ſinners yet notwithſtanding god maketh v ryghtuouſe excellent precious maner angel reſpect nature onely otherwiſe partaker glory ieſus chriſt bycauſe common head chriſtes rightuouſneſſe giuen vnto v farre excelleth rightuouſneſſe angel heerein wee haue cauſe magnifie goodneſſe god meane ſeaſon let v come matter eliphas purſueth heere treateth thing true ſelfe rightly applyed witte wicked neuer haue rest ſuche vnquietheſſe neede none hangman torment themſelues heerevpon concludeth amiſſe iob wicked man although hee aſtoniſhed greefes yet notwithſtanding hath bene ſayde already hee ceaſſed truſt ſtill god doctrine therefore ſaid good holy ſame muſt bee applyed accordingly cauſe tolde reading holy ſcripture wee muſt alwayes pray god giue v skill diſcretion perceiue end tendeth drift wee may fare better ſhall bee ſhewed v wee ſhall goe continually backward god driue v forward ende may take profit conteyned let v followe proceſſe eliphaſsis wordes heere mee ſaith rell thee haue ſeene hee ſpeaketh owne experience afterward hee addeth ſame doctrine receiued hilde ſame manner among wiſe men whome god hath giuen grace able rule well thē ſelues alſo haue gouernment realmes country addeth hild peaceably paſſing ſtranger ſay without man vſurping whiche god put handes verely whenſoeuer god indueth men excellent gift muſt diſpiſe ſame conſider ſprite god dwelleth ſo skornefull refuſe tell v iniurie thereof redoundeth mortall wight liuing god thereafter god vttereth gracious giftes ſo haue v alſo receiue oure common profite eliphas therefore hath ſome good colour pretence alledge authoritie ſuch ruled realmes country yet inough except knowe god ſpeaketh performance thereof ought truſt authoritie men true god commaundeth v bee teachable bee ſtubborneharted harde yeeld obedience knowe thing told v true ſo ye ſee howe authoritie men ought bee receiued fall turning truth vpſide downe conuerting falſhood reaſon men ſhould bee wended vnto thē therefore muſt beare point wel remembrance wee ſee two vngracious extremity one men reiect knowledge wiſdome men among v whome god hath aduanced aboue others vnto whome hath dealt greater abundance holie ſpirite certaine ſayde afore deſpiſing wrong offered vnto god neuerthleſſe wee ſee many ſtubborne folke meanes ſubmit themſelues counſell aduiſe man alſo another extremitie poſſeſſed forecōceiued opinion man skilful great wit wel experienced ſo ſotted therewith wee looke whit wee muſt ſuffer ſelues led ſo god doth alwayes reſerue owne right himſelfe verely ſhould ſubiect alone ſpecially cacos ſaluation▪ true ordinance ciuill pollicies men whereto wee muſt obedient yet referred vnto dependeth vpon meane ſeaſon ye ſee reſolute poynt god haue v taught hande yeld ſuch authoritie vnto mē elſe rob god authoritie preheminence extremitie therefore condemned well meane betwixt theſe two vice wee ſee god hath beſtowed gracious giftes vpon man muſt haue eſtimation take counſell willingly hand vnderſtand deſpiſing doe wrong vnto god bycauſe ſhould honor ſuch ſo yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſſe diſcerne leaſt beguiled vnder ſhadowe ſome opinion ſhall haue conceiued ſome mortall man therby turned right waye god alſo diſfeated preheminence ſame thus muche concerning poynt eliphas addeth theſe men haue concealed thinges learned forefather vvherein ſheweth behaued themſelues faithfully whenſoeuer god giueth v grace well taught doth ourſelues intent others alſo ſhould drawn ſame knowledge ſhould v bee partaker togither thing hath bin giuen v heere ye ſee god inſtructing v firſt end ſee neighbor ignorant ſhould indeuer leade v ſame way wherevnto wee ſelues entred already hee knoweth god truth muſt keepe cloſe himſelfe though alone vvhat bound neighbour therefore ſee go aſtray let reach hande let call hym let ſhewe hee knoweth wee neede bee afrayde ſhall bee preiudice hinderance v thoughe men bee made patakers god hath gyuen firſt vnto v man haue ſmal ſtore worldly goodes ſurely deale forth vnto others ſhall ſoone ſee ende god hath inlightned v worde alſo giuen v ſpirite wee laboure giue vnto others ſhall wee bee inriched ſelues thus yee ſee ſentence wee ought marke well eliphas ſayth thoſe whome god giuen ſingular giftes aboue others concealed thing learned aunceters heere alſo yee ſee marke god gaue vnto ſeruaunt abraham ſhewe hee would vſe well faithfully couenant receyued abraham ſayth hee indeuer teache houſholde thoſe come hee ſhewe ordinaunces statute lorde lette v marke well god openeth oure eye ſo gracious v teach v truth end euery man ſhoulde keepe himſelfe men haue parte portion muſt much v lyeth draw world nowe ſeeing bound men general yea euen vnto thoſe whome god hathe giuen v charge ought houſholder towards ſeruauntes child vvhat ought miniſter god worde doe ſpecially appoynted office vvhat ought magiſtrate ſeing ſword giuen vnto ſitteth god ſeat let v marke well although haue nothet wife child ſeruantes yet notwithſtanding god haue beſtowed gifte v̄pon v bound diſtribute abroade make common men edification marke one poynt much reaſon man haue houſholde ought ſo much watchfuller carefuller inſtructe teache thoſe whome god hath committed whome ſhall render account ordeyned shepherd feede god people muſte imploye ſtrength power therevpon nother muſte openly particularly conceale haue receyued according wherevnto sainte paule ſheweth hee cleare blud ſay faultie god hee taught god truthe faythfullye without ceaſſing well home theyr houſes openly abroade alſo let magiſtrate parte looke himſelfe let negligence quenche lyghte god hath put vttermoſte power let indeuer iuſtice maye reigne haue hir full courſe god maye honoured truth receyued leaſings thinges contrarie true religion may done away lo wee haue remember ſtreyne nowe whereas eliphas ſayth god giuen land ſtranger paſſed expreſſe receyued excellent prerogatiue aboue certaine man able mainteine gouernement put hande token god fauoreth becommeth acknowledge benefite pollicie manable throughly alſo wheras eliphas ſayth thoſe ſpeaketh reigned peaſably god bliſſed ſuch wiſe troubled ſo guided ſubiectes dominion conteined quietneſſe thereby done vnderſtand god maynteineth ſtates countrie peace wee muſt father vpon mortall men acknowledge ſpeciall benefite god acknowledging muſt honoring men whome god ſerued turne alſo yeelding god due prayſe nowe let v come chiefe article haue touched eliphas ſaith wicked man alway trauelling childe neuer hath rest hee continuall tormente hee looketh euer ſworde knoweth number dayes lorde vſeth ſame threat againſt tranſgreſſers lawe namely ſende ſuch fearefulneſſe life ſhall hang afore thread eye ſhall bee ſunken heade ſhall bee ſuch anguiſhe mynde morning ſhall ſay warrant mee life vntill night night come howe maye indure till tomorrowe lo howe god puniſheth ſuch walke purely according law good faith pureneſſe life deſire reſt toſſed care behoueth v knowe god protection muſt fully reſolued certayne wee may paſſe fire water ſay hap hap wee ſhall bee ſure good ſtedfaſt leaningſtocke wee knowe god watcheth ouer v leaſtwiſe wee thinke hee againſt v wee muſt needes afrayde knowe become therefore without cauſe god vſeth ſaid manace againſte tranſgreſſers law ſo eliphaſsis ſaying true wicked alwayes fearefull according alſo prophet eſay likeneth thought wicked folkes waues beate one againſte another vvhen tempeſt yee ſee water ſtirreth waues come ruſhing one againſte another breake aſunder euen ſo man ayded god one paſsion ſhall carrie away torment ſhall bee many contrary hee ſhall bee ſuch pecke trouble hee ſhall bee vtterly wittes ende ſo tolde v wicked man ſuch vnquietneſſe let v aſſure oure ſelues god rightfull vengeance vpon thoſe haue ſought bee peace howe maye wee haue peace god walking good pure conſcience ſpecially knowing wee haue none foundation ſtande vppon ſaue onely mercy wee bee fauoure lorde ieſus chriſtes ſake wee call vpon aſſuring oure ſelues bee happie life death bycauſe pleaſeth preſent v receyue v gather v vp himſelfe marke ſay howe way men haue peace god aſſure ſelues ſinnes forgiuen praye vnto therewithall walke obedience ſo indeuer haue good pure conſcience towards neighbour peace ioyned ioye sainte paule termeth ioy holy ghoſt bee ſtrengthened fayth saint paule ſayth ioy ghoſtly vſeth terme purpoſely bycauſe wicked ſometimes reioyce ſay friske laugh merrie thing goe well forget themſelues ſuch ſort feele owne miſerie become dull yea peace god filleth ſhall bee nothing profite manner peace drawe neere vnto god rather turne tayle vpon true peace happie bliſſed god wee haue eye vntoo come thervpon quiet aſſuring ſelues hee receyueth reckeneth auoweth v bee ſo giue v vp guide v always life death thus ye ſee wee haue remember ſentence howbeit true eueramong faythfull ſuche trouble man hardly diſcerne betweene diſpiſers god yet end god ſetteth reſt handling manner hee maketh knowe owne weakeneſſe maye humble themſelues learne call vpon put themſelues wholly hande truſt altogither hys goodneſſe moreouer ſomtimes pricketh ſpurreth v come earneſtly beſeech reach v hande ſhew hath care v whenſoeuer bee toſſed ſorte neede vnlode care lappe reſt ſelues caces take contentation comforte yee ſee faythfull may well ſtricken feare troubling yet god make feele peace hee wont giue thoſe although ſame appeere firſt brunt yet end ſhall alwayes bee comforted according ſayd pſalme lorde thou haſt comforted mee ſorrowes mynde god may well holde v ſhort ſometimes ſet v libertie end heere ye ſee howe eliphas addeth ought expounded namely extorcioneres euer perſon full violence ſhall knowe number yeeres faithfull poynt well furthermore heare requeſt dauid maketh shewe leaſtwiſe ſayth hee time maye take affliction good woorth perceyue ſhall laſt euer vve haue ſeene lyke requeſt made iob himſelfe ſaying hee knewe length time long god mynded hold heere vvhy doth eliphas referre ſpecially bee deſpiſers god ſuche full pryde outrage cauſe full care thought life yet mean wote account part knowe wee haue certaine terme heere howbeit wee ſhall continue heere ſo long pleaſeth god mainteine v seeing wee bee come worlde god hath ſet v heere wee muſt giue leaue holde v heere take v away pleaſure meane ſeaſon wee heere howe telleth v worde hee guideth v altogether haires heades numbered wee neede bee afrayde thing though wee beſet neuer ſo many daungers wee ought ſurmiſe thinges mingled togither worlde fortune beareth ſway although wee bee ſillie wormes earth yet doth god thinke vpon v hath life hand keepe well ſafely ought ſuffiſe v know protection god seeing ſay aſſured god keepeth reckening yeares dayes yea numbereth verie haires head perceiue ſufficient certaintie ſo without cauſe eliphas ſayth extorcioners knowe number dayes ſeeke great anguiſh may ſaying may liue yet ſtill ſure haue made long diſputations great diſcourſes always turne backe continuall vnquietneſſe bycauſe reſt themſelues vpon god prouidence part muſt ſo muſt pray vnto haue put liue hande may quier whatſoeuer trouble befal v knowing forſomuch hath made v faſhioned v able deliuer v daungers whenſoeuer liſteth ſhew himſelfe deliuerer thervpon muſt conclude watch ouer v aſleepe much bee thought eliphas addeth namely outrageous man doth alwayes beliolde ſworde ſay hee doth ſee infinite daungers hem rounde reaſon hee qu • keth agaſt agreeth properly vnto tyrantes true ſtate may well ſeeme bee happye howbeit ſo troubled myndes perceyue bee better haue bene ſmall bace degree bee ſo honored feared yet meane themſelues afrayde onely men alſo euerie leafe ſhaketh vpon tree verely tiran confeſſed much one flattered ſayde prince ſuch maieſtie might ſeeme god worlde euerie man might deſire ſtate thou ſayth hee wart like cace kneweſt much thou wouldeſt wiſhe chaunge thy ſtate myne herevpon cauſed goodly banquet bee made ready ſetting familiar friend place cauſed naked ſworde bee hanged ouer head poynt downeward vvhen ſawe daunger could nother eate drinke braueries eſteemed ſo highly afore made account eliphat meeneth namely tyrant cruell folke ſhal alwayes liue feare notwithſtanding ſeeme bee well eaſe haue great power gardes haue ſworde continually eye man demaund whither faithfull ſhall feele daungers threaten yes certainly yea good v feele wiſt warranted wee would care runne ynder wing god would play colt broken looce god therfore faine warne v put v mynd beſieged thouſand deathes wee bee able ſtep forth one pace without tumbling graue vvhen wee conſider withall ſee plague warres famine ſuch ſtore miſeries ſuche ſtore diſeaſes ſo many inconueniences beaſtes thinges ſo looke howe many creature ſee heauen earth wee ſee many deathes leaſtwiſe many thinges againſt v bethinke v ala wee bee wretched creature god pitie v moreouer prouoked runne vnto ſaye lorde thou ſeeſt thou ſheeld thy hand haue one minute houre liue therefore good lorde voutſafe preſerue see howe faythfull beholde ſword howbeit beholding behold alſo grace god made priuie danger wherein flee ſayd ſuretie ſhewed v ſo often ſcripture put whole truſt god hee onely wall dubble rampire v ſayde prophet eſay alſo wall braſſe ſteele worde inuincible fortreſſe vs▪ lo howe faithful hauing behild ſworde neuertheleſſe behold god protection well aſſured although death ſeeme manace ſides yet ſhall ſword come doe come yet ſhall fall headlong men ſay wicked ſhall ſhare haue fearefulneſſe beholding ſworde ſhall ſinke ſtomackes make ſay beholde ſuch daunger ſuch miſchaunce light vpon meanes ſhift ſide ſhall ſee god purſuing dart ready ruſh vpon bowe bent▪ witte thunderbolt ſtrike downe maruell though greatly quiet great diſtreſſe ſo wee ſee difference betwixt feeling daungers child god trouble feareſulneſſe vnbeleeuers true ſometimes faythfull ſhall ſee ſworde afrayde feare bringeth touched afore witte god putteth mynde humble themſelues afterwarde draweth home himſelfe giueth reſt whereof deſtitute tyme profite thus ye ſee haue remember ſentence eliphaſsis haue knowledge theſe thing wee may well apply doctrine oure inſtruction ſoulehealth firſt ſee ſtate man ye ſee liuely picture wherein lord ſheweth v wee bee world muſt bee put feare alwayes haue reſt ſometimes diſquieted verie well yet euerie man go 〈…〉 th aſtray euerie man ſhrinkes away god miſchiefe increſeth groweth dubble therefore behooueth terrours increaſe alſo become much terrible may daunt v vvhy ſo vvee haue made warre againſt god good reaſon ſhould much v yea al creature ſhould armed againſt v done much ſee diſeaſe wee muſt come remedie acknowledge god wil forſake v tarrieth till come ſeeke preuenteth v goodneſſe ſheweth v call vpon may well put life handes good faythfull keeper vvhen knowe ſhall wee ſee god doth v much good maynteining v taking vpon charge office preſeruing v exempted v daungers put cace men worlde earthly paradiſe ſo nothing might trouble ſhould bee ſo happie middes many affliction trouble finde god commeth downe ſay abaſeth himſelf ſo low thinke vpon watch preuenting inconueniences beating backe daungers might befall putteth himſelfe betweene harmes intent ſhould ouermated troubled meaſure▪ furthermore let v vnderſtand god doe nowe leaue v withdrawe himſelfe v hide himſelfe ſuch wiſe perceiue ſuccoure aſſured protection muſt diſmayde pray voutſafe ſhew v countenance may ſee aſſurance according ſee howe dauid ſpeaketh lorde ſayth make thy countenance ſhine vpon v much better v abundance kynde good vvhen dauid ſawe himſelfe ſuche afterdeale ſeemed god giuen sathan wicked men brydle yea troubled alſo mynde ſo came help aboue lorde ſayth hee deſire thou make thy countenance ſhine vpon v ſay thou giue ſome little taſt thy goodneſſe knowe thou haſt receyued thus yee ſee howe behoueth v deſire god put away groſſe thicke cloudes hinder v perceyue loue beareth towardes v furthermore wee ſee wicked ſuch trouble vnquietneſſe let ſame bee brydle vnto v muſt profite ſelues god vengeance wee ſee farre vpon wicked vve muſt tarie till god bende himſelfe againſt v til rap v hard vpon pate no▪ hee ſpare v meane ſee puniſheth thoſe haue deſpiſed ſhaken yoke let ſame ſerue holde v awe warineſſe ſo wee may ſay ala ſee heere theſe wretched caytifes haue aduaunced themſelues pride preſumptuouſneſſe againſt god paiment haue ſee need hangman torment vvhy tormenteth god perſecuteth thē ſort let wake v holde v back caſt ſelues boundes beſides let v alſo ſo much giuen ſeeking peace ineſtimable benefit treaſure let v hunt ſo much buſily calling remembrance paul ſaith peace god ſaith hee paſſeth vnderſtāding mā kepe hart mind ſay ſure protection god wee reſort vntoo doubting hee receyueth v owne child ſaith maner peace ſurmoūteth vnderſtāding man vvherby doth v witte wee comprehende except god giue v holy ſpirit verie deede muſt bee faine worke v make v come poynt way haue marke howe concluſion ſayd noiſe feare ſhall alwayes ſounde eares wicked deſpiſers god moſt quiet extorcioner ſhall fall vpon heere eliphas ſpeaketh twoo thing one wicked proſperitie ſodain deſtruction ſhal fal vpō like ſtorme perceyued inſomuch ſaid thē ſay peace ſure oueruaunt thēſelues agaynſt god laughing threatnings ſcorne euen come paſſe god ſhall ouerthrow miſtruſt leaſt true ſcripture muſt needes bee fulfilled wicked ſhall feele thing afrayde contrariwiſe alſo god ſende feared roote ſuddainly lande ye ſee howe eliphaſsis meening euen middes peace pilling polling ſhall light vpon deſpiſers god cheefeſt thing ſaid ſound fearefulneſſe whiche ſhall alwayes afright holde vpon racke kinde thing ſound whiche god ſendeth euen al thing reſt noiſe al trouble yet neuertheleſſe muſt purſue inſomuch ſhall ſtart tremble according ſee example caine beholde caine reſt yet purſued god appointed iudge arreigne neither bodie ſtande agaynſt verely bloud abell cried vengeance men hee ſure ynough hee triumphed hee built citie name eldeſt ſonne euery man ſtoode awe yet meane quaked like leafe tree wherof came euen ſecrete voyce voyce herd eare yet ſame dreadful noiſe inſomuch although wicked knowe god ſheweth yet notwithſtanding ceaſe continually agaſt nowe heare let v pray god make v heere alſo ſweete amiable voyce whereby hee ſendeth v tidings fatherly goodneſſe loue thus ye ſee remedie whereby may bee deliuered ſayde fearefulneſſe aſtoniſhment wicked diſmayde v beſeeche god make v heare voyce goſpell hee telleth v receyueth v louingly father hee accepteth v rightuous lorde ieſus chriſts ſake life death hee alwayes holde v hande vvhen voice ſoundeth eares ſo wee vnderſtand throughly ſhall diſmaide theſe deafe blinde ſcarings vnbeleeuers wee ſhall bee ſurely fenced againſt diſmayings betide v therefore haue recourſe vnto god holy ſpirite giue v grace reſt vpon promiſes let v doubt ſtabliſh v good thing hee ſhall haue giuen v ſo ſtrengthen v power terrours worlde ſhall euermore ſtand ſtedfaſt vntill haue taken v eternall reſt nowe let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele diſlyking meane time wee may ceaſſe truſt lyke hee receyueth wretched ſinners vnto mercie thing wherein hee vttereth richneſſe gracious goodneſſe ſo alſo may pleaſe make v partaker thereof therewithall may pleaſe alſo continue hee hathe begonne v vntill haue brought v full whole perfection▪ ſo let v ſay almightie god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe according truth wee bee woorthie lyft vppe eye heauen preſent oure ſelues thee preſume ſo farre c lx sermon fourth vpon xv chapter 23 hee vvill trotte vppe dovvne breade knovving time darkeneſſe hys hand 24 anguiſh amazeth ouercommeth king prepared battell 25 bycauſe hee hath lift vp hande agaynſt god ſtrengthned himſelfe agaynſte almightie 26 vvill leape vpon necke cruſh ſtrongeſt part ſhield 27 hath couered face vvith fat fatted bovvels 28 hath inhabited deſert city ruinous houſes vvere falne dovvne 29 ſhall aduaunce himſelfe rich ſhall continue neither ſhall bee remainder yeſterday ſhewed howe many miſeries daungers life ſubiect inſomuch wee muſt alwayes needes tremble feare ſeke reſt god knowing hath care v mainteine v ſhould neuer quiet moreouer whē vouchſafe heare voyce peace whiche god prepareth ſendeth v muſt ſcared men iuſt puniſhment vnthankfulneſſe ſuch receyue ſo great benefite impoſsible god ſhould beare beholde god ſheweth v firſt hee willing forgiue v ſinnes although deſerue bee ouerwhelmed hand yet deſireth nothing one v mercie addeth taketh v intoo protection keeper life wee worthie bee deliuered vnto satan refuſe honour priuiledge onely vexed men alſo quake afrayd though man purſue v let v learne reſt ſelues vpon god ſticke promiſes hath giuen v end may walke ſafely quietly heere beneath middes daungers nowe eliphas addeth wicked man ſhall trot vp downe bread knowing day darkeneſſe hande lay forth ſentence ſayde god impoueriſh wicked howe great rich ſo euer haue ſo muſt bee faine beg true curſſe conteyned law heare alſo howe ſayde pſalme rightuous neuer forſaken ſeede begge breade god nurriſheth thoſe tyme dearth god prouide ſuch wiſe faythfull one ſuccour neede wee muſt thinke ſtraunge contrarie part hee plucketh benefites wicked men handes bycauſe ſotted make idol certenly ſee riche folke worlde become hungerſtaruen notwithſtanding deſpiſe bothe god men beare themſelues hande cauſeth god nowe ſpoyle ſtrip ſuch wiſe ſeene go begging notwithſtanding ſuch abundance erewhile readie burſt place eliphas ment ſay onely ſpeaketh need wherevnto bee brought deſpiſe god meeneth alſo euen middes rich ſhall ſtill full care whitte better poore folke ſhall thinke themſelues go may ſhall want wee ſee experience although god giue vnbeleeuers euer wiſhe ſo haue garner cellers full money wherewith buy corne wine yea although haue prouiſion made yet afrayde earth ſhoulde faile true ſometime men like ſterue hunger ſeemeth themſelues haue great ſtore according ſee lorde ieſus chriſt ſheweth example rich man ſayth go heart merrie take thine eaſe thou mayſt ſport thee thy pleaſure haue ſtore goodes layde vp thee heere riche men therefore may well truſt goodes yet al may ſtil doubt ceaſſe thinke may hap fall ſuch inconuenience ſuch thing may light vpō ſhort haue touched alreadie vnſatiable gulfes although whole worlde yet woulde ſuffice thus yee perceyue eliphas ment ſaying wicked ſhould runne vp downe bread wee ſee looke vpon verie rich man happen little loſſe hee make fisking hee reſt till haue compaſſed hath taken hand muſt pine martir himſelfe meaſure bring matter paſſe hee muſt rayſe yet new ſtock money get withall dare eate one bitte without carke care leaſt wiſe eate halfe fill himſelf repineth thoſe eate neuer well eaſe till haue pinched much ſerue compaſſe thing goeth trotting vp bread man hath wherewith finde halfe ſhyre thinkes himſelfe haue nothing bycauſe hee able ſtaunch owne deſire god puniſheth manner contrarie vengeance therefore ſee ought vnderſtand right well bee worſe blinde god executeth notable vengeance vpon ſuch men vengeance worthie remembred man haue pleaſure neuer beeing reſt man ſhoulde grudge v meate drinke woulde ſeeme vnto v hee went ſtarue v wee woulde blame crueltie whiche ſhould ſo man owne friend doo good himſelfe thinkes hee hath halfe ynough although haue hundred time hath need apparant god hath blinded yet notwithſtanding vice hath reigned tymes therefore without cauſe eliphas doth heere ſet v downe iudgement god ſaying wicked ſhall trot vp downe bread hee addeth knowe day darkneſſe handes expounde ment day darkneſſe hande elſe trouble elbow ſay god pay ſuche wage haue deſerued whereof commeth ſo fo 〈…〉 gred middes abundance god hath giuen hee hath fraughted benefites yet notwithſtanding dare neither eate drinke vvhereof commeth puniſhed crueltie reuenouſneſſe deceytes haue vſed towards neighbour yee neede ſeeke farre cauſe wherefore puniſhed maner looke howe haue troubled poore folkes raked mennes goodes raught themſelues whatſoeuer coulde finger ſo muſt god fayne recompence agayne thus yee ſee darkeneſſe handes ſay miſeries indure proceede theyr executing tirannie againſt poore folkes ſpared plaine meening theſe wordes namely knowe day darkeneſſe handes whatſoeuer paynes ſo euer take although rich mightie yet winde themſelues affliction god ſendeth vpon certaine euer couetous ſort prouide may neuer want well aduiſed woulde bee contented haue cannot away haue ſayd alreadie god ſo blindeth become ſo dul cannot perceyue goodes haue ought ſuffize heerevpon practize euer may trie meanes bring matter one way ſerue ſeeke another way wood couetous ſort therfore haue handes idle take vpon remoue whole world rather diſappoynted purpoſes dayly making newe ſhiftes terme yet meane ſee darkeneſſe handes ſay haue done prouide themſelues haue vſed meanes poſsible yet ſhift handes beeing continuall miſerie god hath bereft benefyte according ſayde pſalme god giue reſt welbeloued whereas meane wretched vnbeleeuers ſhall ryze early go late bed dare eate bread ſorrow yet notwithſtanding ſhall themſelues whit thereby ſo may eaſily perceyue god hath bliſſed increaſed workes handes vvee ſee contrarywiſe whiche ſet downe heere namely wicked ſhall haue much adoo labour hand agaynſt god ſay labour miſlyked ſpite teeth muſt fayne knowe affliction laid vpon therein rid handes haue notable ſentence wit abundance good able ſuffice v cannot make account bee eaſe bycauſe haue ſtore corne wine money matter bee founde perfection happyneſſe god giuing reſt faythfull one let v lear • giue oure ſelues outrageous couetouſneſſe wherewith wee ſee moſte part world caught caried away haue betaken ſelues vntoo god let v pray make v feele foſterfather let v receiue whatſoeuer giueth v crauing ordinarie food hand without attempting vnlawfull meanes abſteyning robberie violence deceyte▪ ſuch like thing deſiring nouriſhed ſhall pleaſe ſhewe v fauour thus ye ſee wee haue marke firſt place furthermore let v pray ſo bliſſe labour handes wee may perceyue thing incloſed therein rather make countenance ſhine vpon v ſay make v find fauour goodneſſe giuing v good ſucceſſe men labour doo get liuing honeſtly haue wherof thank god therby perceiue god hath inlightened fauour creſſet guide therefore haue cauſe pray god furthermore wee nowe recoyle backe ſteade going forwarde let v learne counſell god reſort vnto pray ſuffer v companie thoſe ſee ſo much darkneſſe handes rather hath giuen v meane make proſper ſuch wiſe may knowe hee neere hande v thus ſee effect haue remember ſentence eliphas addeth aſmuch lifted vp hand agaynst god ſtrengthned himſelfe againſt almightie god take necke catche holde ſtrongeſt thickeſt armour reaſon rendred lord ſendeth fearefulneſſe vpon wicked tormenteth alſo diſappoynteth attemptes turneth thing cleane contrarie intent namely bycauſe lifted vp themſelues againſt true mortall man bee aſhamed thinke making warre agaynſt god wicked themſelues ſo farre beeing acknowne minded lift vp themſelues againſt almightie abhorre verie worde yet ceaſe proofe hereof need ſend trumpetter god defie mynd make warre againſt trouble neighbour wrongfully vſe deceyt extortion behold▪ god ſetteth himſelf againſt v thought made warre againſt againſt mortall creature would ſo mad ouerſhoote ſelues ſuch ſort wee conſidered ſelues god ſheweth ſelfe enemie outrageous woulde lift vp ſelues faſhion againſt fall outrage pray full incountering againſt god vve take ſo yet ſo neuertheleſſe vvhat ſhould neede sophiſtrie behalfe ſayd afore ſpeake making warre againſt god ment chalendge herault trumpet ſo proude preſume vpon ſtrength power take vpon v god giueth v leaue doo certayne come ruſh agaynſt god much diſquiet poore folk go ſet foot vpon throte therfore fall aduauncing ſelues wiſe aboue boundes one wee defied god face ſo ſentence woorthie rememberance fliphas ſayeth god leape neck thoſe aduance themſelues ſort agaynſt hee ſayeth expreſſely lifted vp handes agaynſt god verely ſimilitude taken thoſe fight battell neuertheleſſe meening extendeth yet eliphaſsis meening men take vpon lawfull vſing outrage iniurie god take part neighbour agaynſt true cannot compaſſe matter meanes go ſome deceyt priuie packing although world perceiue yet doth god ceaſſe enimie nouriſhing wicked affection ſecretly within howbeeit ſhall bee ſo much vnexcuſable iniquitie ſheweth ſelfe abrode therefore polleth man goodes ſhall hild murtherer god yea euen though wrong hee doeth may excuſed men ſo eliphas ment ſhewe men ought thinke ſtraunge though god take ſuch vengeance wicked haue cloked wrongfull dooings haue made knowne whole worlde good fayth ſhal haue runne ſort ſhall haue eaten vp one fleeced another ſhall haue executed many extortion cruelty high time god ſhoulde ſtep afore neuer nought hee reporteth ſelfe bee defender poore vexed wrongfully apparant yea oftentymes crie vnto god vengeance wherefore doo poore folk indure ſuch thing ſeemeth god leaueth brier willing doo right ſuch temptation behoueth v reſort holy scripture ſayth namely yet conuenient time knoweth maketh delay nothing elſe giue tyme repentance thoſe euill make vnexcuſable alſo ſtirre vp poore folke oppreſſed call vpon flee vnto betake themſelues wholly prouidence aſſuring themſelues ayd ſuccour ſeeth meete expedient welfare howbeeit ſee god worke deede hath taried long time ought open eies behold iudgements ſhould ſtill dazeled afterwarde addeth ſtrengthned themſelues agaynſt almightie vvhen ſayeth ſtrengthened themſelues hee meeneth hardened ſelues howe poſsible men ſhoulde gather ſtrength lift vp themſelues agaynſt god may going ſea land aſſembling helpe poſsible found thē ſtrengthen themſelues falſe imagination haue ſuch ouerweening themſelues thinke themſelues able withſtand god directly mynde bycauſe forget god able harme ſo would ſo ſtubborne euill neither would bee ſo wilfull men ſhewe fault labour reclayme therfore pride ſtubborneſſe ſeene men ſure record take themſelues bee ſtrong mightie ynough beate backe hand god commeth againſt lo ſaying ſtrengthned themſelues bee vnderſtoode deede impoſsible diueliſh ouerwening bicauſe ſhake feare beare themſelues hand ſhould indure iudge▪ ſhort ought owe god ſo much dutie come account therwithal become bolder giue themſelues ouer naughtineſſe though lawfull doo liſt eliphas giueth title almightie vnto god purpoſely according circumſtance place god time ouercome eliphas intēded ſcorne pridefulneſſe wicked ſtrengthning themſelues maner againſt god meene almightie yea ſhal become ſtrength ye incoūter creature wouldſtand ye hand knowe ſtrongeſt ſith make warre god muſt ye needes ouerthrowne ere ye come hand ſtrokes ſtrength yea whereas yee haue borowed ye come turne againſt thinke ye hee ſuffer ſtrength whiche hath giuen diminiſh whitte maieſtie muſt needes ſerue confounde withall yee ſee cauſe eliphas hath expreſſely ſette downe worde almightie reproching men ſtrengthning thēſelues agaynſt god haue yet one good profitable leſſon gather hereof wee haue warre god muſt bee well ware abſteyne euill wrong▪ muſt liue among neighbour without working anoyance iniurie aſſoone wee doo ſtirre one finger poll men goodes trouble one deuour another beholde god chalenged v make warre v bycauſe wee haue gone aboute euill towardes hee hath taken vntoo tuicion vvee ſee earthly prince haue giuen protection houſe man doo wrong ſimple felonie high treaſon whereof bee auenged doo wee imagine god bee leſſe priuileged prince hee hathe ſet badge vpon poore folke taking owne charge protection nowe man come torment afflict ſuffer ſayde let v learne brydle ſelues ende wee vſe outrage againſt neighbour alſo let v keepe ſelues frenzie ſpoken heere bee well wittes take ſelues mightie ſtrong god therefore let v aduiſedly walke modeſtie acknowledging frailtie nature let v humble ſelues let ſame ſerue holde v within boundes knowing thing whiche god permitteth v knowe let v bee contented walke plainly oure waye wythout running ouer feeldes like ſtray cattell elſe ſtrengthen ſelues agaynſt god wee preſume doo god hath forbidden v ſhall wee eſteeme bee ſingle diſobedience diueliſh furiouſneſſe let v vncace ſelues pride preſumption ſimplie followe god ſheweth v wee tempted nowe ſayde vaine fancie let v marke well woorde almightie brydle v withall ſaying howe nowe wretched creature wilt thou doo wherevpon muzeſt thou thou ſtrengtheneſt thy ſelfe thine euill beholde god telleth thee hee lift vp himſelfe agaynſt thee thou muſt faine feele thy foe mortall enimie therefore reſtreyne thy ſelfe except thou intende feele mightie hand able deſtroy thee quite make cleane riddance thee marke ſay wee haue note ſentence furthermore let v hearken howe eliphas addeth god • aze wicked folkes neckes bee neuer ſo well armed ſo haue helmet ſheelde god ſeaze vpon thickeſt furn ture vvhereas hee ſayeth god ſeaze wicked necke ſhew ſhall bee caught ſuche wiſe cannot meanes eſcape ſayde man hilde necke hee ſhet vp extremitie diſtreſſe god therfore ſheweth hee deale ſame faſhion wicked folke handle ſtrokes cudgel onely giue blow twaine ſeaze vpon neckes choke good reaſon ſhoulde ſo ſee howe cruell haue beene neighbour haue hilde foote vpon throtes muche coulde god therefore muſt vſe gentle correction towardes aſſayling muſt bee extremitie confuzion foraſmuch wicked truſt armour artillerie bicauſe bee well furniſhed foraſmuch needes barre god comming ſayd purpoſely nippe thickeſt armour reſiſtance fortifying themſelues againſt god ſhall boote whit againſt force ſhall haue corſ • et ſheeld yet god compaſſe intent vvherby warned walk continually feare ought afraid god puniſhings according holy ſcripture ſayeth dreadfull thing fall handes liuing god let v ſurmize wee haue doo mortall man aſſoone god threatneth let v fall flatte ſo hardharted ſwell agaynſt god wrath king ſayeth salomon meſſenger death wrath god himſelfe god ſendeth v woorde diſpleaſure ſee wee howe death preſent backes therefore let v misbehaue ſelues helpe wee haue handes men creature let v thinke ſelues bee euer neerer purpoſe imagin cace well prouided wee fight agaynſt creature might auayle v foraſmuch oure warre god wee ſerue turnes agaynſt hee hath hys hande hee diſpoſeth pleaſure vvhen ſhall purpoſe march one ſide make v turne head another way thinke good yee ſee howe haue conſider wee arme ſelues agaynſt god owne ſword muſt cut throte god ſende armie agaynſt v neither needeth make prouiſion wherwith deſtroy v wee ſelues ſhall woorke owne decay therefore ſayde let v truſt owne fence meanes heere bylowe aſſuring ſelues thoſe thing ſhall nothing profit v haue doo god againe ſee wicked adtraunced ſo neckes ſwell threeſcore thirteenth pſalme ſpeaketh inſomuch ſeemeth ſhoulde burſt puffed neckes let v neuertheleſſe wayte alwayes paciently till god laye hande vpon knoweth well howe daunt ſo ſwelling ſhall vaniſh away intoo ayre wee ſee wicked haue ſo great furniture ſeeming bee ſure euill befall let v thinke let vntoo god hee ſhoulde ouerthrowe deſtroy time commeth muſt afrayde ſee wicked floriſh cheefe ruffe rather ſo well vphild vnderpropped ſeemeth bee delt withall god god ſay muſt fayne ſtrike ſtroke hee putteth foorth hande may well ſeeke helpe ſuccour handes creature yet ſhall bee caſt downe vtterly deſtroyed lo howe faythfull haue wherewith comfort themſelues ſee wicked men rage deſpizing god infected al rebelliouſnes rather otherwiſe hardned ſuch ſort impoſsible make bow might knowe ende god performe hath ſayde ſpoken hath bene ſpoken eliphas ſentence vttered holy ghoſt euen two conſiderations haue ſpoken wit faithfull might holde themſelues modeſtie lowlineſſe attempt thing againſt god ſee wicked haue full ſcope world thēſelues borne many wrong ſhould caſt vp ſighes vntoo god deſyring performe hath ſpoken according alſo good call vpon haue onely refuge vnto conſequently ſayd diſtreſſe ſhall light vpon wicked come vpon king prepared battell rather wind word eliphas vſeth ſignifieth ball bowle round thing knowe commeth giuing battell ſomtymes men caſt themſelues ring according cace requyreth ſo done olde time therefore ſentence may bee expounded diſtreſſe ſhall king readineſſe giue battell whenſoeuer god ſhall ſende affliction vpon wicked ſhall bee like enimie hath power ſtrength lyke king hath ſouldiers ynowe giue enimie oüerthrow elſe man may referre ſayde roundneſſe wicked whiche ſhall bee inuironed ſydes ſay ſhall haue way ſcape god ſeaze vpon ſhall bee beſeege one ſyde behynde right hande left ſhall bee ſo incloſed ſides▪ ſhall bee ſtartinghole moſt conuenient interpretation let v marke well eliphaſsis meening god minded puniſh man long tariance long ſparing ſhewing himſelfe bee angrie pacified come ſides ſo hee may neuer ſcape handes thus ye ſee effect ſentence herevpon haue yet one good leſſon gether bee put mynde v dally god forſomuch bee ouerpreſſed hande wee may well woorke wyles wee wee ſhall neuer bee able ſcape diſtreſſe wherewith ſhall pleaſure pinch v aduerſitie wherevnto ſhall ſubiect muſt bee faine tarie ſpite teeth god hath woonderfull furniture like mortall men ſpitte choller mouth handes bee ſhort meane euen king prince themſelues ſtorme well ynough ſtrength fayleth neede ſo god hath alwayes furniture ynough compaſſe enimies withall vvhat remayneth let v beware wee make warre agaynſt performance thereof let v forbeare iniurie euill wee play looce coltes wee ſhall finde length god hath meanes ynow reyne v backe force wee liſt ſubmit ſelues vntoo owne good immediately ſayde forſomuch hath fatted eye foraſmuch face ſtrouteth greace much hath ſtuffed bellie foraſmuch hee hath ouer larded guttes inhabited deſoate townes forſaken houſes ſhall come decay prosper verely intent ſentence may bee better vnderſtoode wee muſt lay foorth maner although wicked man dwell deſert townes yet crammeth bellie bodie bearing himſelfe hande hee ſhall make worlde newe againe hys dooings woonderfull yet ſhall go decay althoughe hee make fayre ſhewe tyme yet ſhall hee continue god ſhall turne vp ſyde downe howbeeit yet comprehende eliphaſſis meening except wee knowe firſt fill mannes face greace fatte god dooth heere condemne fatneſſe mennes body vſeth ſimilitude hee intendeth expreſſe men puffed vp pride proſperitie bicauſe thing maketh v forget owne infirmitie lo lorde ſayeth fatneſſe blindeth v deede common prouerb among v ſay prouander pricketh men alſo hebrewes intend ſpeak lowly man vſe ſay caſt downe lord tameth v ſuch wiſe affliction learne humble ſelues rid ſelues quite cleane pride pertneſſe like reſt holy scripture ſo alſo ſentence ſayde wicked fatted ment ſimply fatte body take ſuch pryde good rich puffed vp agaynſt god full poyſon preſumptuouſneſſe although bee leane bodie yet readie burſt another curſed fatneſſe foraſmuch puffed vp agaynſt god yea ſee fatneſſe wit diueliſh malapertneſſe maketh eye ſtrout heades ſayde threeſcore thirteenth pſalme eye good halfe burſten reaſon bleare ſelues delightes pleaſures conſider may bee bereft one minute houre marke ſay howe fatneſſe blindeth wicked howe good burſten owne ſhame deſtruction nowe let v come ſentence eliphas ſayeth wicked ſhall proſper reaſon bicauſe hee puffed vp fameſſe vvill wee bliſſed god bee mainteyned good ſtate true happineſſe let v kepe v well pampering ſelues fatneſſe ſay let v keepe v pampered wyth pryde wee preſume make ſelues let v walke mildeneſſe knowing depende vpon hande god hee hath lyfted v vp hee alſo ſoone caſt v downe agayne therefore let v bee moued ſo muche ſerue honour let v bee ſo vngracious giue occaſion ouerthrowe hee hath buylded deſtroy quite bicauſe wee woulde make towre babilon prefume lift vppe ſelues agaynſt euen ſo happeneth ſayeth eliphas although wicked haue inhabited deſert city ſay although haue ſuche ſcope might ſeeme woulde make world new inhabite deſert townes much bee contented poſſeſsion thing good plyght fyght agaynſt god might bee newe maker worlde ſetters vp thing deſtroyed wicked may well haue outwarde ſhew ſhall continuance bicauſe aduaunce themſelues againſt god contraripart vndone ſtripped ſtarke naked god ſhew v fauour build vp againe thing forſaken condicionally go vaine pryde preſume thing vpon ſelues deſire reach v ſtrong hand ſo guide gouerne v alwayes holy ſpirite hee hath begon ſhew gracious fauour towards v hee continue ſame bring perfection nowe let v fall downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele ſuch wiſe may learne miſlike ſelues foraſmuch ſo much giuen pryde vaine preſumption may pleaſe open eies perceiue owne feebleneſſe infirmitie wee may run wholly vnto calling vpon acknowledge haue power ſtrengthen ſelues furtherfoorth pleaſeth quicken v death rayſe v vp againe life moreouer hee mainteyne v fauour make v ſo feele bodie ſoule may deſire nothing yeeld ſelues wholly ſeruice example wee may allure others lyke humilitie ſo may bee honoured glorified great ſmall dooing hereof may pleaſe rayſe vp true faythfull c lxj sermon fifth vpon xv chapter 30 ſhall depart darkneſſe flame ſhall ſindge braunches ſhall go avvay vvith breath mouth 31 ſhall deceyued vvith vanitie ſhall ſtand vanitie chaunge 32 ſhall conſumed time braunches ſhall floriſh 33 ſhall bereft ſoureneſſe vine god ſhall caſt olife tree dooth floures 34 congregation hypocrite ſhall deſolate fire ſhall deuoure houſe brybes 35 conceyueth miſcheefe bringeth forth vanitie belly prepareth deceyt yeſterday ſaw howe deſpyſers god aduaunced themſelues ſuche wiſe may ſeeme none god gyueth great aduauntage fauouring ſuche wiſe mainteyne themſelues ſtate make new worlde yet notwithſtanding ende cannot bee curſed ſhamefull eliphas addeth newe ſaying wicked ſhall depart darkeneſſe herein diſcerneth child god affliction indure thoſe whome god hath vtterly reiected may come paſſe ſhall bee darkneſſe wee ſee holy prophet complaine god hath withdrawne light ſo grope knowe way turne neuertheleſſe god giueth end haue languiſhed time reacheth hand draweth ſayde wicked ſhall neuer ſet darkneſſe ſhall abide ouerthrowne without ende hereby ſayd diſcerned thoſe god afflicteth tyme hee meeneth ſuccour ſayde god deuoure braunches ſay howe greatly ſoeuer bee aduaunced god cōſume place take braunches child ofſpring whole ſtate ſurely vnder terme comprehended euer ſpringeth tree v vnderſtande god ſhall haue puniſhed wicked may well conceyue many hope beare themſelues hand ſhall ſpring againe theyr hope ſlope ſayeth eliphas vvhy ſo fire ſhall conſume ſay god wrath ſhall fire burne vp likely releeue againe ſhall ſo finally addeth wicked ſhall go away breath mouth true may wel verified god ſcripture ſayeth oftentymes god conſume wicked onely breath hys mouth ſhewe power hee hath puniſh wicked enemy god needeth arme ſelf neither needeth make preparation puniſh thoſe hee liſteth let onely open mouth breath vpon enimies behold ouerthrowne deſtroyed like god word quickeneth v pleaſeth inlighten v grace wherein conſiſteth welfare lyke though good dead yet bee releeued ſoone god ſheweth v fauour ſo contrarywiſe vttereth wrath againſt wicked hee needeth opening mouth drown deſtruction ſame alſo cauſe saint paule ſayth antichriſt hath reigned church laſt ſhall conſumed wyth breth god mouth according haue alledged prophet eſay termeth mace wherwith god woont breake daunt al enemy liſteth haue ſonne reigne ſentence therfore vnderſtood ſome wicked neuer get affliction neuer ſhall delyuered darkneſſe wherinto entred bycauſe god purſueth hath mouth open conſume worde ſuch power ſhall make periſh vnhappily howbeit true fit meening wicked man ſhall go away breath owne mouth ſay puffe verely ſome alſo vnderſtand thus namely wicked may well gnaſhe teeth chafe themſelues yet god touch lay hand vpon play bulles ſome mouth like wilde bore vve ſee haue greate breathe chafing fretting win ſturdineſſe reſiſtance againſt god able ſaue ſo ſhall true conuenient leſſon howſoeuer wicked doo ſtriue agaynſt god full pride bitterneſſe ſoeuer yet ſhall therfore eſcape god hand ſaue themſelues ſhift notwithſtanding muſt come ſenſe ſpake bycauſe moſt agreeable namely wicked ſhall go away breth ſo neede open mouth byand vaniſh away ſhort▪ eliphas ment ſay▪ wicked make greateſt ſhewe themſelues afore men ſeemeth ſhall continue without ende ſhall chaunge inſomuch ſhall ſooner breathe ſhall fordone ſo ſhall bee breath commeth oute mannes mouth know man puffeth breath vaniſheth away ſodenly becōmeth nothing therefore let v marke well although deſpyſers god ſeeme haue laſting life yet ſhall ſoone vaniſhe away ſo without cauſe likened breath true ſame thing verefied men wee firmneſſe nature wherin conſiſteth life true ſoules created image god yet man life blaſt breath vndone yeelding vp gaſpe dead ſo frailtie whereof eliphas ſpeaketh deſpizers god men furthermore haue wherwith comfort v god preſerueth v although life ſo fleeting ſhadow ſmoke yet notwithſtanding ſure ynough ſeeing hand god thus ye ſee wherein whole comforte lyeth therfore let v aſſure ſelues twaine witte nature wee nothing may periſhe euery minute yet notwithſtanding god infinite goodneſſe putteth difference betwene v enemy haue caſt ſome muſt periſh blaſt although languiſh ſo like liue paſt giuing one gaſpe yet neuertheleſſe god wyll ſtrengthen v power yea euen ſecrete power ſhall beare ſhew worldward yet ſhall ſo mainteyned ſhall ſtill aliue wicked go waſted away lo haue beare away ſentence conſequently ſayd wicked beeing deceyued vanitie ſhall ſtande bycauſe vanitie ſhall bee chaunge true ſentence vnderſtoode dyuerſly woorde tranſlate ſtand taken alſo beleeue ſo ſome expounde wicked man beeing vanitie beleeue vanitie ſhall chaunge againe double vnderſtanding worde ſo whereas wee reade vanitie worde rightneſſe certentie ſayde wicked man beleeueth bee true vvhyſo bycauſe vanitie chaunge neuertheleſſe moſte receyued commoneſt conſtruction namely hee ſo deceyued vanitie ſhall ſtande continue beleeue vanitie chaunge touching worde beleeue followe conſtruction wee may picke good leſſon god bereeueth men witte diſcretion neuer receyue good warning profitable counſell vvhy ſo ſtubborne doo yee ſee puniſhment god wee muſt marke well bee afrayde except god make v conformable wee ſhall neuer diſcerne good profitable beſides although wee haue men v giue v good counſell ſeeke profite v ſhew v good v yet notwithſtanding ſhall ſo frowarde euer ſayde v ſhall take place ſee dayly god bereeueth men vnderſtanding ſhewe vengeance vppon make vnexcuſable hee giue men leaue ſpeake ſtill counſell incourage ſtill goodneſſe ſhal continue ſtill ſleepe man aske whether willingly periſh anſwere man put minde ſaluation man ſhewe poynt way leuer breake necke tumble ditche readie walke way called vnto vve ſee therefore ſo much muſt wee marke well ſuch iudgements god wee may walke warely ſmall thing tempt oure god ſuch wiſe muſt bee fayne picke oute eies ſo may knowe ſyde turne v although hee reache v hande ſhewe v waye good v go yet wee go quite contrarie beholde horrible vengeance yet wee ſee dayly ſuch wilfull haue often tempted god reiecting grace ende forced fall ſuch blindneſſe diſcerne ne beleeue doctrine fayth alſo heere ye ſee common gift vnto men beleeue goſpell vve ſee woorde god preached ſhoulde gainſaying men wilfull frowarde vvhereas god declared himſelfe father sauiour aboue thing whereas ſeeing v full ſinnes giueth v warrant oure ſaluation perſon ſonne aſſuring v although bee full iniquitie yet notwithſtanding lord ieſus chriſt hath ſatisfied v ſo meanes death paſsion ſet cleere may appeare god iudgementſeate bee hilde rightuous giltleſſe pray vtterly brutiſh v woulde giue eare earneſt deſire ſee goſpell deſpized yea many conceyue ſuch rancour agaynſt would rather pluck god oute ſeate ſubmit themſelues hys doctrine whereof commeth man power beleeue benefite vntill bee giuen god men left themſelues giuen vp lewde minde muſt needes reiect goodneſſe chooze euill altogither owne deſtruction foraſmuch wee ſee let v humble ſelues aduaunce himſelfe owne conceyte muſt ende bereft vnderſtanding behoueth v keepe allegeance vnto god hath giuen v right minde cleere vnderſtanding good reaſon leaſtwiſe wee muſt confeſſe ſame commeth pray continue v ſuffer v abuſe ſo ſingular gift rather cauſe v applie right vſe namely yeelding ſelues obeyſance ſticking throughly doctrine ye ſee thē haue ſee ſo many poore blinde ſoules wandring ouer fieldes able diſcerne thing euen though man would guide ſhew right way woulde neuertheleſſe draw ſtill contrary way ſay muſt acknowledge ſelues ſhoulde doo like god ſtrong hand hold v drawe v himſelfe ynough call v ſhew v way ſhould go muſt bee faine draw v alſo holy ſcripture ſayeth ſay muſt giue ſuch operation knowledge hee offereth v may touched oure harte tyed therefore god hath taught v doo hee muſte alſo immedatly therewithall giue v minde followe good ſo ſayde wee may gather good profitable leſſon ſaying wicked wyll beleeue bicauſe hee deceyued vanitie reaſon added expreſſely bycauſe man forepoſſeſſed naughtie affection ſnarled many errours corruption yee ſee like deſperate perſon comming ſhewe errour howbeit wee bee deceyued vanitie hande nature bring wee oure moothers wombe ſayde nothing fooliſhneſſe vntruthe vnderſtanding beholde generall ſentence ſhewe ſoone wee bee borne worlde bee quyte cleane voyde truthe afore hande vntill ſuche tyme god haue reformed v wee go forewarde altogither vntoo euill therefore wee ſhoulde bee ſhet vp condemnation ſorte v god drawe v oute hys mercie wee v deceyued vanitie none fit receiue good true profitable welfare wee bee intyced manye deceites satan beguyle v hande howe marke mee yoong man hath liued ſimplicitie lyfe hath liued long tyme example admitte bee yoong man twenty yeares age hath bene well brought vp beginning hath taſted falſe doctrine wicked thing although ſuche one ſeeme bee ſufficiently well diſpoſed receyue goodneſſe yeelde himſelfe teachable yet muſte god bee fayne woorke elſe neuer come good oure nature forwarde vnto euill altogither gyuen vntoo ſayde afore bee one wylye full naughtineſſe hath bene nuzled wicked doctrine ſuperſtition wee ſee papiſtes muche theſe clawebackes hypocrite armed long time afore hand againſt god carryed headlong away theyr errours haue ſuch wyſe applyed theyr whole indeuor intangle themſelues ſnares satan poſsible get agayne certaine theſe ſorte men muche leſſe beleeue wee ſee experience god dooth ſtill ſhewe fauour thoſe haue ſimplicitie thoſe ſo ſotted erroure wholly giuen iuſtice god muſt needes bee ſhewed vpon except bee pleaſure woorke woonderfull faſhion according hee well drawe whome hee liſteth bottome hell hee doeth ſo miracle well worthie bee knowne magnified neuertheleſſe wee perceyue whiche ſayde namelye wicked man ſhall beleeue hee ſotted vanitie ſay wee perceyue god executeth vengeance vpon ſuche hardened euill long continuance nowe heare wee haue cauſe thanke god drawing v knowledge goſpell giuing v minde cleaue vntoo commeth ſelues ſpeciall gifte holy ghoſt moreouer alſo wee bee warned keepe eye open satan dazell v ſetting erroures deceyts ſight wee ſuffer ſelues bee miſſeled deceyued willinglye miſcheefe muſt needes increaſed euen till come proofe wherof eliphas ſpeaketh wit till wee bee diſfurniſhed reaſon bee able beleeue whiche welfare ſette ſelues quite cleane againſt fall horrible vengeance god let v preuent let euery v bee heedefull ſtande vpon garde ſith god hath taken vppon charge keepe v ſo carefully hee telleth v nother satan force practizes ſhall able thing againſt v let v ſtick promis doubt wil fulfill make v feele frute due time place let v come whiche ſpake ſay wicked ſhall ſtand woorde importeth muche beleeue like alſo word truth may alſo ſignifie ſtedineſſe true wicked ſhall ſtand ſotted vanitie vanitie chaunge reaſon ſerueth fitly confirme principle wicked ſhall haue ſettling finally proſper god maketh turne alwayes vanitie worde vanitie taken two ſenſes ſayde wicked man ſhall ſtand bicauſe ſotted vanitie much ſay cannot ſtande hee full vntruthes blinded deceyuableneſſe vanitie ſee worde altereth ſignification chaunge ſaye nothing deceyuableneſſe hee thinketh haue thing harte luſt vaniſheth away turning hande ſo findeth nother help releefe aduerſitie anye remedie miſeries thus yee ſee woorde vanitie importeth ſeconde place woorde chaunge fitteth well ſenſe god ſhall haue led wicked ſorte throughe manye turmoyles ſhall haue buskled themſelues throughly fro whiche ſide ſo euer turne ſhall alwayes fall vanitie ſay ſhall vtterly diſappointed theyr expectation true may ſette manye fayre hope eye beare themſelues hande haue wonne goale beholde turning hand bee deceyued ſee follie gape one thing nowe lette v come gathering togither thing ſpoken heere one ſumme namely wicked ſhall ſtande ſay ſhall haue anye ſetling continuance althoughe deſpyzers god bee exalted triumphe tyme yet haue ſettledneſſe god leadeth continually thorough backewayes ſuche ſorte fynde themſelues beguyled diſappoynted theyr hope profitable leſſon v cauſe wee grudge wicked woulde fayne bee parttakers ſtate bycauſe wee haue pacience tarrye ende ſayde pſalme oure mindes quiet certayne wee ſhoulde ſhudder ende prepared deſpizers god bycauſe laſte theyr ioy muſte turned weeping wayling gnaſhing teethe god curſeth theyr mirth ende muſt needes vnhappy wee raught onely preſent thing runne luſtes ſo whot wee haue forecare may happen tomorrow morning ſo much ought marke well leſſon whē ſayde wicked man ſhall haue ſettling ſaying thē taught bridle ſelues ſee deſpizers god haue theyr full skope liue theyr eaſe yea euen whyle wee weepe lament ſo wee ouerſhoote oure ſelues giue god leyſure finiſh worke againe let v take heede wee like well proſperitie let v grounde ſelues vpon god man proſper let dole vpon good fortune terme nother let v bee ſo miſcarried forget god lette v ſeeke ſettle ſelues without ſhall bee ſtedfaſtneſſe reaſon eliphas addeth heere immediatly muſte bee throughly weyed witte chaunge wicked ſhall vanitie wherfore ſee many turning worlde ſeemeth v alwaies worlde prooue better better v bycauſe men feede themſelues wind god afflict hope vpon maruelous thing ſubſtance ſtedineſſe enterpriſes thus thē yee ſee effect wee haue marke right ſenſe ſayde afterward wicked man ſhall bee conſumed tyme braunches ſhall neuer floriſh ſhall bee lyke vine hath vnripe grape ſtript like olife tree casteth floures yea ſame floures ſhead away cōmeth froste ſo periſhe vtterly doubte theſe two ſimilitudes eliphas ment confirme former ſentence ſay wicked man periſheth hee bee full ripe ſerueth ſtill bring v backe matter whiche wee haue diſcourſed already ſee ſetting eye ſtableneſſe wicked lorde calleth v continuing ſtableneſſe ſhal deceyuable ſerue alonly tickle v vayne fonde deſire god intent ſhoulde deceyued vayne imaginacion weening ſelues happie would haue v bee happie good earneſt howe may bee ſettling oure ſelues loue lo wherevnto hee calleth v contrarywiſe hee ſheweth v wee muſte bee gyuen theſe worldly thing reſte vpon reſte bee wee bee ſtarke fooles wee beate oure braynes aboute yet cannot turne v notwithſtanding god tell v proſperitie happineſſe men weene themſelues haue world bee ſeparated deceytfulneſſe muche ſtandeth v hande marke well leſſon ſayde wicked ſhall periſhe tyme whereas hee addeth theſe compariſons hee ſhall bee vyne hath ſowre grape plucked oliue caſteth flower tyme ſo bring foorthe frute heereby lorde intended expreſſe outwarde ſhewe wicked ſhall haue whereat ſhall wonder yea alſo ſtumble wee ſee wicked proſper immediatly wee bee amazed ſuche fyre kindled v wee coulde finde hart bee ſaying ſuche one beholde yonder naughtypacke eaſe meane put behind doore ſee ſettes foote vpon throte haue meanes reuenged see howe oure affliction chafe v withoute meaſure ſoone ſee wicked proſper contrariwiſe oure lorde ſayeth v vvell sir true yee may ſorte bee tempted beholding goodly ſhewe men luſtes ſuddeyne headie yee ſee howe vine ſtripped vnripe grape new burieoned needeth one froſte kill grape bee growne bee full faſhioned beholde falleth ſtorme ſweepes awaye ſo remayneth nother grape leafe vine left bare alſo looke vpon oliue tree wherein beautie floures yet notwithſtanding floures froſtbitten tempeſte light vpon caſte euen ſo felicitie wicked truly ſeeming poore ignorant folke proſperitie ſhall bee ſuche nothing may ſeeme deſirable theyr cace anone floure frute fade away bee rype god plucke away come perfection according tolde ſhall come ſo much perfectiō ſhoote floures frute ſhall taken away come ſeaſonable thus yee ſee effect ſhewed v heere ſayde afore ſerueth confirme matter hathe beene diſcourſed already let v learne hereby deſire felicitie laſteth paſt day avery little time lette v learne bee throughly happy lorde would haue v bee well ſettled aſſure ſelues bee bliſſed god ſame ſhall make v proſper onely daye twayne alſo bothe life deathe true muche aduerſitie may befall v meane whyle priuiledge haue whē may betake ſelues vnto god know lay vpō v able beare ſpecially turne aduerſities oure welfare ſaluation seeyng haue prerogatiue haue wee wherewith bee contented although wicked theyr eaſe preſent time certeintie haue time come although aduaunce thēſelues thinke god able ſhake ſayde pſalme yet haue ſtings within god woundeth pricketh elſe toſſeth ſyde ſide ſuche ſtormes able auoyde let v marke deſire god fauour haue continuing proſperitie muſt grounded neuer quayle vvee knowe ſayde another ſentence pſalme wicked ſpoken namely bee like greate tree whiche men ſtub vp ſo remayneth printe plucked vp roote contrary parte muſt dauid ſayeth bee like olife houſe lorde whiche floriſheth alwaies alſo ſimilitude takē ſame ſort firſte pſalme ieremie mente truſt god runne vnto hang vpō ſhall bee like tree planted water riuers ſide ſo wee ſhall alwaies haue good ſappe floriſh bring foorth frute ſeeing ſo god hauing drawen v corruption vayne alluremēts world offereth v alſo euerlaſting happineſſe muſt need wit go let v bethinke v well learne bereeue ſelues luſts fleſh ſerue nothing deceiue v yea leade v deſtruction learne know welfare lyeth thus yee ſee wee haue beare minde ala hard thing ſayde afore vve ſtraitewayes drawen hath fayre ſhew therefore ſtandeth v hande marke well ſimilitudes eliphas bringeth heere vve ſee olife tree looketh faire continuaunce lette v alſo haue eye storme hande vpon wicked god holdeth poynte beate downe althoughe wee perceyue firſte daſhe yet wee looke god iuſtice eyeſight faith wee ſhall ſee rooted god cannot come full ripeneſſe neuer bring foorth good frute ſhall ſoone come plucking vp god hath ſayde vvee ſhall ſee drowned owne pride god word cannot lye ofte bee moued ſenſualitie fooliſhe imagination let v retyre god woorde looke whiche wee ſawe afore ſpecially thing hydden may know thervpon turne away vayne conceites deceyue v lo wee haue beare away ſtreyne ende ſayde houſeholde wicked ſhall deſolate fyre ſhall conſume houſe brybes vnder terme hypocrite according ſenſe textes alſo eliphas comprehendeth ſuche haue frowarde diſloyall harte godwarde ſayeth hee muſte periſhe yea euen houſe retinue afterwarde addeth houſe brybes ſhall conſumed vvhereas ſpeaketh companie hypocrite expreſſe better althoughe wicked haue greate traynes greate long tayles yet ſhall miſſe bee conſumed ſhall yee ſee farre wickedder men common ſimple ſort ſhall carrye greate company bandes whiche make greate ſhewe ſhall haue alliance aſſemblies ſo drawe long traynes eliphas ſayeth expreſly ſuche aſſemblies ſhall come nought meening ſhewe howe true wicked mainteyne themſelues time thoſe alliance fortifie themſelues purpoſe mainteine ſtate ſomuche euery one thinketh himſelfe ſtrong ynough beare bruntes wrath god kindled burne vp yea wee ſee howe prophete ſpeaketh hee likeneth faggot thornes man haue gathered bryers thornes made faggot wyll bee ſo ſnarled hee wyll bee loth put hande hee ſhall knowe ſide take holde ſpecially woulde draw abough hee cannot hee put fyre immediatly kindle crackle caſt farre greater blaze faſte ſubſtantiall woodde euen ſo wicked like thornes bryers bee plaſſhed one within another man cannot tell howe vndoo nother hee well come ſoone god putteth fire muſt needes cracke peeces vtterly conſume hande ye ſee eliphas ment ſaying aſſemblies hypocrite ſhall periſhe meening wicked man maye drawe greate trayne bande men ſhall ſtand ſted mainteyne againſt god wrath ought aſſure v wee ſee wicked men ſo furniſhed ſo allyed ſo garded yet ſhall therfore miſſe bee ſuddeynly caſt downe conſumed ſo wee ſhall ſee ſpoken nought hereby wee admoniſhed knit ſelues togither right feare god haue none bande hold v linked togither ſeruing good conſcience putting whole truſte helping one another finally haue ſuch agreement among ſelues euery v may ſette minde walke faithfully god man wee deale ſort god bliſſe concord otherwiſe muſt needes go wrecke hauock purpoſely ſayd houſe brybes bryberie ſhall come nought buyldings haue bin ſet vp pilling polling muſt needes periſh decay themſelues meene onely houſes buylded stone timber meene man enricheth himſelfe bryberie rewardes ſo hee draweth one ſide ſnatcheth ſide giuen ſcraping deceyuing extortion hath doone hee gathereth woodde commeth little ſparke god wrath conſumeth euery whit woodde fire take holde wicked pyle vp ſuch ſtacke al ſides wood ſerueth wood burne vp theyr traine text ought well borne minde wee may walke ſoundly purely thus much firſte poynt ſeeing warned wicked ſorte haue inriched themſelues receyuing gift brybes ſhall end go deſtruction let v repine lette euery v looke himſelfe walke owne calling let thoſe called ſtate iuſtices ware mainteine themſelues without bryberie remember howe ſayde giftes blinde eye wiſe peruert vnderſtanding rightuouſe therefore let abſteyne corruption intent may continue cleere ſounde marke ſpeciall poynte agayne let thoſe bee priuate ſtate walke vprightly alſo let euery man bethinke himſelfe go maye aduance ſelfe world vſing wicked trade howbeeit muche bee thing condemned god ſhall onely kindle wrath againſt lo faithfull ought hold themſelues awe moreouer whē ſee wicked lay baites euery ſide beare themſelues hande haue greatly gayned haue gotten muche rich taking bribe gift let v ſay yet god lēgth ſhew hath vayne ſayd heare place whiche holy ghoſt hath vttered mouth eliphas▪ god wil ſuffer threatnings vayne match execution thē anone after▪ ye ſee muſt quiet ſee ſuch rap rend pill poll ſides verely muſt aſſure ſelues thing ſhall continue god take ſuche order bene farre better haue eaten bare breade haue bene contented little thā haue glutted themſelues faſhion men coſt haue drawen themſelues make themſelues rich euery whit muſt go nought houſes muſte fall vpon heades ſay good haue gathered ſhall bee ruine deſtruction true time ſhall haue ſuch ſcope may well ſeeme ſtate ſhall laſt euer let v pacient tarry god leyſure ſayde afore till finiſh woorke meane lette v deſire nothing ſtande grace fauour truely onely meane mainteyne v ſtate time life alſo giue v better life death hath promiſed v kingdome heauen nowe let v caſte ſelues downe preſence oure good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying gyue v ſuche repentaunce wee maye chaunge naughty life day daye deſire thing renounce al naughty affection thing may turne v ſeruice greate number wicked luſtes wherevnto ſubiect giuen forſomuch wee ſo full infection may pleaſe vpholde v mercie dayly pardon v faultes vntill hee haue fully clothed v agayne rightuouſneſſe ſuch time ſhall haue taken v worlde make v part taker heauenly glorye may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo c lxij sermon first vpon xvj chapter little remnant laste verſe fifteenth chapter 1 iob anſvvered ſaide 2 haue often hearde ſuche thing yrkſome comforter 3 vvhen vvill bean ende vvindy vvoordes vvherevvith imboldeneſt thou thy ſelfe anſvvere 4 coulde ſpeake ſoulevvere ſoules ſteade coulde holde company talke coulde nod heade 5 could ſtrengthen vvith vvoordes talke ſhould receiuegriefe 6 ſpeake▪ ſorrovve vvill abate hold peace vvhat releefe haue 7 hath loden vvith anguiſh hath made congregation deſolate 8 hath parched vvith vvrinckles vvitneſſe leanneſſe come vpon mee vvhiche vvitneſſeth face 9 hath torne mee vvrath hee hath handled furiouſly▪ grindeth teeth mee mi 〈…〉 emie ſharpeneth mee ſtareth vvith eye agaynſt eliphas hath told v wicked deſpizers god curſed matter go againſte concluſion hee addeth conceyue ſorrowe bring foorth peyne aud belly breedeth craft deceyte vvhereby hee doeth v witte outwarde ſhewes whiche wicked folkes haue boote awhit god turneth cleane contratie theyr thinking meanes whereof▪ bee diſappoynted expectation true ſentence expounded thoughe reaſon eliphas rendreth witte▪ god afflicting curſing wicked hypocrite without cauſe nothing practize miſchiefe whole worlde therfore trouble neyghbours ſo payed like meaſure truely holy scripture doth oftentimes vſe manner ſpeaking ſeuenth pſalme eſay alſo ſayeth ſame nine fyftieth chapter therefore holy ghoſt meeneth declare men giuen naughtineffe ſinne intentes thought affection vſeth ſimilitude woman child vvhen haue conceiued peine ſaieth ſay whereas haue conceiued deuiſed miſchiefe agaynſt neyghboures trouble oppreſſe bryng foorthe iniquitie ſay execute miſchiefe deuiſed ſenſe agreeth texte haue ſayde already eliphas hath already heretofore rendred ſufficient reaſon god ſhould ſo much againſt wicked meeneth ſay although behight themſelues good hope beare themſelues hande ſhall compaſſe theyr matter ſome meanes yet ende ſhall bee confounded bicauſe nothing god bliſsing maketh v proſper therefore ſhall winne nothing foding themſelues hope theyr harte god ſhall turne topſiteruie heere scripture ſpeaketh maner ſixe twentith chapter prophet eſay ſayde lorde haue traueled thy face woman childe yet haue conceyued brought foorth nothing winde verely faithfull ſpeake complaine wiſe god howbeeit acknowledge confeſſe theyr ſinnes time ſayde traueled woman childe god perſecute iuſtly offence ſay cōceiued brought foorth wind ſay aſſoone looked ſome eaſe theyr miſeries vaniſhed altogither intoo ayre ſmoke long lingering peyne miſerie neuer awhit amended eliphas paſſeth ſayth wicked breede childe bring foorth miſchiefe themſelues bellie nurriſheth deceyte ſay vayne guilefull hope ſhall deceyue ende ſame threatning god vttereth three thirtieth eſay againſte skornfull whiche haue made none account worde ſpecially whiche haue bin hardened behold ſaith ye cōceiue chaffe bring foorth dung ſhould ſay bee ſtubborne againſte word bicauſe ye cannot perceiue euill haue committed howe ſore haue prouoked wrath agaynſt flattering ſelues ſhall ſtande ſteade notwithſtanding youre flattery ſhall perceiue haue conceiued nothing chaffe ſtubble ſhall vaniſhe away ayre ſhall know flattery haue profited nothing wee ſee effecte eliphaſsis meening wicked may time well eaſe god preſſe ſo hard ſhall fode themſelues ſome hope yet ſhall god beſte worſt ſo preſſe ſhall haue worme gnaw within theyr owne conſciences ſhall alwayes prick ſhall haue remorſes ſtings torment ſecretly yea ende god ſhall ſende ſo ſtrong exceſsiue anguiſhe ſhall bee dryuen force bring foorth whiche haue bred inwardly bellie conceyued nothing guyle ſaye although perceyued theyr owne harmes firſte yet nothing worke owne decay ſeeyng fauoure god warranted themſelues yet came cace nothing playne deceyte nowe lette v come iobs anſwere hee telleth firſte hee often hearde like thing therefeore bee yrkſome comforter ſpecially ſetting vpon ſo troubleſome woords ſaying often heard like thing hee meeneth ſhoulde haue brought ordinarie common remedy ſeeing miſerie ſo greate extreme ſhoulde rather haue brought ſome louing comforte ſuche mighte haue ſerued turne haue hilde ſuche talke men woont doo ſlight faſhion meaſurably afflicted thus yee ſee iob meente ſaying hee oftentimes hearde ſuche matter afore ſurelye whenſoeuer man bringeth v comfort wee acquainted withall afore wee muſte holde skorne of▪ why▪ though inſtructed cōcerning god goodneſſe exhorted pacience day▪ may eſcape oure remembraunce wee ſhall neuer thinke vppon true matter bee darke vnto v neuertheleſſe bee afflicted man put v remembrance hath bin tolde v afore lette v thinke needeleſſe talke why▪ cace ſtandeth vpon practizing haue heard • e vnderſtood howbeit yet touched quicke bicauſe occaſiō ſerued god nip v diſtreſſe heauineſſe▪ doth make v taſte comfort men haue drawen worde brought vnto v good faith iob none theſe nicelings alwaies longing wote nouelties cannot abide man ſhould tell thē one tale twice ſay haue hearde afore haue hadde mine eares cloyed tale yea yet haue neede haue beaten thē ſtill man telleth v one thing often greate profit furtherance iob poynt greeued make account good leſſon bicauſe it▪ common nother curious deſires ſaide afore hee ſheweth ſimply miſerie ſo exceſsiue hee neede comforted extraordinarie manner like man ſicke common diſeaſe folke alſo vſe lighte remedie diſeaſe bee ſharpe▪ phiſition muſte fayne proceede ſhould applie one medicine diſeaſes thing like cace aduerſities vvee ſee man ſorrowfull deathe father wife child elſe ſome loſſe happened vnto vvell one bringeth ſome meane comfort ſuch god hath ſet foorth bee tormented ſome one manner onely whiche feeleth hande god perſecuting ſides ſo ſoone one inconuenience befalne followe two three mo necke hee onely afflicted body perſon goodes frends alſo haue ſeene iob preſſed ſpirituall temptation thoughe god meent drowne vtterly muſt go work exquiſite faſhion ye vexe poore man already hartbroken purpoſe ſhall bring ſerue muche better man hilde peace god myght worke ſupply default men thus ye ſee iob meent beholde eliphas telleth iob god puniſheth wicked men ſhew himſelfe iudge world may well fence thēſelues cannot ſcape handes hee vtterly deſtroye howe greate traynes bandes men ſoeuer haue man ſhould apply matter vnto iob muche beare downe god hys enimie bycauſe hee wicked man alſo bene nothing hypocriſie beholde matter miſapplyed therefore withoute cauſe hee ſayeth gotoo knowe theſe thing euen nowe coulde ſerue myne owne turne neede cace iob conceyued minde hee puniſhed ſinnes ſake god ſuche intente hee felte himſelfe faultie woorthy indure yet god liſted examine rigoure bicauſe hee knewe god handled ſo ſinnes ſake another intent iob knowing reiecteth talke hild bycauſe vnreaſonable yrkſome comforter mee ſayeth hee reaſon bycauſe brought conuenient remedy heereby wee bee warned wee minde comforte neyghboures heauineſſe trouble wee muſte go randon many men doo haue ſongs one haue regarde whome ſing ſome man muſte bee handled one faſhion ſome man another example bee one ſtubborne againſt god cace man muſte ſpeake another manner ſtyle tearmes poore creature hath walked alwayes ſimplicitie ſo according maladie needefull man bee warned proceede thereafter example men bee dullardes muſte bee cryed vnto negligence muſte bee rebuked intente maye feele hande god humble themſelues vnder ſame therefore wee haue neede greate wiſedome wee comforte thoſe whome god afflicteth wee ought doo thus yee ſee wee haue beare minde concerning ſentence ſayde ſuche pretended comforte iob yrkeſome comforter bycauſe broughte thing whereby hee might fare better nowe iob addeth vvhen bee ende youre wyndy woordes hee tearmeth thoſe woordes wyndy wherein ſubſtance ſaye whiche able edifye man according holye scripture vſeth ſame ſimilitude requyred man ſhoulde bee taughte howe obtayne saluation ſayde hee edifyed howe euen bycauſe hee firſte founded afterwarde buylded vppon ſo hee confirmed feare god hee confirmed lawe hee confirmed pacience beare affliction ſtedfaſtly afterwarde hee fully reſolued praye vnto god prayſe flee vnto contrariwiſe word trouble one brayne man trifle babble ſo hearer receyueth good inſtruction apply welfare wyndy wordes ſo lette v marke meddle exhortation doctrine aboue thing behooueth v tende ſayde ſubſtantialneſſe witte ſuche heare v may receyue ſome good inſtruction ſo maye bee inured walke according godlyneſſe bee grounded truſte mercye frame themſelues call vppon doubtinglye waueringly aſſuring themſelues ſhall bee hearde yee ſee howe wee oughte ſtudy inſtructe oure neyghboures ſubſtantially thing whiche wee haue learned may ſlippe away like winde furthermore euery v muſte alſo bende ſuche teaching wee couet bee filled wynde wee ſee manye curiouſe folke woulde fayne haue men liſten vntoo myghte feede eares ſatisfye theyr fonde fancy imagine woulde fayne haue men lyſten theyr complayntes diſpute matter edifying minde man ouermuche inclined vice yea wholly gyuen vnto euerie v ſhoulde followe owne appetite certaine woulde bee none queſtion among v howe wee myghte holde vnprofitable talke whiche ſhoulde ſpredde ayre haue ſubſtance aught winde therefore learne ſeeke whiche good conuenient edifye v feare god fayth pacience good profitable thing thus yee ſee wee haue remember ſentence iob maketh mention windye woordes neuertheleſſe wee muſte alſo take heede oure ſelues wee refuſe talke ſhall bee miniſtred vnto v thoughe wyndy wee muſte learne taſte whither bee vanitie good inſtruction may knowe apply oure owne vſe therewithall lette v pray god bee ſo graciouſe v man miniſtreth good doctrine vnto v may ſlippe away v vaniſh ayre owne heedleſneſſe man commeth informe v god worde behooueth v knowe isalwayes ſome good inſtruction towardes many take profit applie whole witte minde fleeting fro god worde doth vaniſhe winde bycauſe haue ſure groundedneſſe neuertheleſſe better applying leſſon vſe euery one v ſayde afore muſte looke narrowly himſelfe followeth iob freendes cace hee coulde ſpeake doo holde company talke pleade nod heade truly ſome expound ſentence iob woulde render like vnto hee ſawe like trouble woulde rather indeuer aſſwage miſeries giue ſome releefe increaſe ſorrowe towardes according wee haue ſeene vnmercifulneſſe none talke among dryue holye perſone deſpayre god hadde hilde vp take ſentence ſenſe mooued thereto reaſon namely vnſeemelye matter iob woulde bee deſyrous reuengemente god withdrawen hande hee woulde mocke poore menne like calamitie hee eaſe although none cauſe affliction hee himſelfe indured yet ſhoulde ſame teache haue pittie compaſsion vppon ſuche neede well conſidered iob meeneth ſhewe heere hee woulde doo man myghte doo hee lyke plyghte therefore hee meeneth hee woulde bee euen wyth hadde troubled wilfullye onely hee coulde bee merrie hee effecte hee meeneth thus talke well youre eaſe yee ſhake head yee paſſe condemning mee plunge mee bottomleſſe pittes thus yee doo folke knowe indure miſerie youre cace coulde doo muche woulde take ſhould come ſhake head youre calamity ſawe hand god nippe extremitie ſhoulde ſay well beſtowed god muſte bee fayne chaſtize make feele howe hee puniſheth ſinners ouerwhelmed miſerie ſhould ſpeake ſorte might yee ſaye skorner cruell perſone bethinke youre ſelues well lo effect iobs meening nowe ſee ſharpened vnto reuengement thoſe haue feare god bee anye man diſquieteth woulde fayne laye power render twice muche diſpleaſure hath bene done iob minde truely ſtandeth god child hande brydle themſelues although men trouble vexe v yet v runne vpon thoſe haue perſecuted v wrongfully god ſendeth vnto v meeken v behooueth v knowe bee roddes come hande neuertheleſſe men come trouble v without cauſe wee maye well example iob tell wee coulde doo like man ſhall neuer knowe faulte well vntill hee bee tolde face man perceyueth miſcheefe may retourne vppon owne heade hee reſtreyneth himſelfe falleth ſaying howenowe vvhat doe beholde god bring v vpright indifferencie ſayeth thou ſhalt none otherwiſe thy neyghboure thou wouldeſt done vnto thy ſelfe truely hee coulde haue ſayde vvhen yee haue doo youre neyghboures ſee yee deale indifferentlye vprightlye yee bee giuen wicked couetouſneſſe ſpoyle men goodes looke yee deſire enriche youre ſelues loſſe man verely ſo ſayeth hee scripture concluſion hee ſetteth downe ſaying doo yee woulde bee done vnto man great clerke matter concerne owne profite wee lyke well diſpute ſay vvhat suche man hath one wrong chriſtians parte doo ſo vprightneſſe poynte lewde cruell man euerye man therefore skill diſpute well reaſon equitie righte cace concerneth owne profite poynte whervnto iob ſendeth freendes bycauſe bee blynde ſaying ſuche extremitie hee woulde bee gladde men ſhoulde handle gentlye therefore hee coulde doo leſſe bryng backe naturall equitie making compariſon betweene himſelfe ſo hee ſayeth come yee like plighte yee ſee mee reaſon ſhoulde miniſter ſuch talke vnto mee man ſhoulde handle faſhion go woorke mee howe woulde take oughte bee mooued haue ſayde already ſo long wee bee oure ſelues ſaye ſo long matter toucheth v ne lyghteth vppon v wee runne croſsing cace touche ſelues learne better aduiſed thus yee ſee effect iob meant ſay nowe may wee gather good leſſon hereof according lord ieſus chriſtes forealleadege ſentence wee ſhoulde doo another man whiche wee woulde haue done oure ſelues wee haue god lawe printed harte haue generall principle abide v cauſe iudgement ſo peruerted corrupted drawe alwayes backwarde god hath ſooner giuen v good rule ſtraightwayes moued ambition hatred pride couetouſneſſe lo peruerted bee
