ambitiouſe vaunte ſelues wee fall deſpizing oure neyghboures wee bee raſhheaded ſo oure tung runne rouers wee well vnderſtande grounde cace led pryde ſo woulde aduaunce ſelues plucking thoſe backe whome wee ſee go afore v wee bee prouoked hatred malice blinded loue parcialitie vvhat bee done let v enter ourſelues pray god guyde v open harte wee may diſcerne arighte ſaying go matter concerned thy ſelfe wouldeſt thou ſaye lo howe wee myght become wiſe diſcreete ſtayed witte applying ſame thing ſelues whiche caſt againſte others wee bee ſo much giuen ſelfeloue ſelfeprofite ſayde nature holdeth v ſo harde euerye man loue yea ouerfarre loue himſelfe therefore wee ſhall bee leſſe excuſed vice founde v ſeeing bee ſo often exhorted followe vprightneſſe indifferencie lette v pray god woorke ſuche wiſe v vice may bee turned vertue holy ſpirite lette v conſider imported ſaying thou ſhalte loue thy neyghboure thy ſelfe vvhat cauſe euery man ſteppeth oute boundes wee loue oure ſelues muche deſpiſe oure neyghbours bicauſe wee bee diligent inough practizing whiche ſayde vnto v namely muſte bee ſo muche giuen loue oure ſelues wee muſte loue neyghboures oure ſelues wee ought conſider god hath created v owne image therewithall wee bee one nature heerewithall alſo hee telleth v wee oughte agree true brotherhoode thoſe linked vnto v thus yee ſee wee haue remember ſentence iob telleth accuſed vniuſtly woulde bee loth others ſhould like therefore meete abuſe pacience faſhion lo wee haue gather effecte ſayde nowe bolde peace ſhall profite mee ſpeake eaſe ſhall haue heere iob intendeth preuente obiection myghte haue bene layd againſt freendes myght haue ſayde comforte thy ſelfe ſeeyng thou arte ſo well able doo ſeeyng thou couldeſt woorke woonders wee cace thou arte go nowe ſhewe thy cunning vppon thy ſelfe hee ſayeth ſee ſelfe miſerable cace maye bee knowe may hope god pincheth ſo ſtraunge faſhion ſpeake increaſe ſorrowe holde peace neuer eaſed beholde man ſwallowed vp aduerſitie thus yee ſee iob meante ſay effect namely whether ſpake whither hilde peace hee way eaſed marke alſo dauid two thirtith pſalme complayneth aduerſitie ſo pinch ſtreyne wiſt become ſhifte make vvhen lament ſayeth thinke haue ſome aſſwagement ſorrow meanes fire kindled keepe mouth ſhut bee minded caſte ſelfe downe god harte vexed ſtill torne peeces greefe nippeth ſo quick neuer awhitte reſtrayned therby another place hee ſayeth hee determined himſelfe ſpeake one worde haue bin dumbe ſo long wicked full ſcope able ſayth keepe touch minded bridle ſelfe maner end boylings fayne burſt like greate fire vnder potte althoughe potte bee couered yet muſt skumme needes leape one ſide well worthy noted god ſendeth v ſickneſſe pouertie ſeemeth v neuer man handled ſo roughly wee bee cauſe either driueth v deſpaire elſe prouoketh v vtter impaciēce ſo fall lifting vp ſelues againſt god elſe beare oure ſelues hand although god afflicteth faithfull haue bene v yet ſo weake wee bee yea vtterly voide paſsions ſame alſo cauſe increaſing oure greefe vvherefore let v remember howe ſayde god hath ſo pinched ſeruants ſay euen thē whome hee loued whoſe welfare deere precious ſight hath oftentimes brought ſuch extremitie able looke vp nother wiſt ſpeake hold peace dauid made ſuche conſeſsion without cauſe inſtruction god child wee ſee man indued ſuch vertue hauing ſuch cō ſtācy holy ghoſt neuertheleſſe throwen downe ſo hee woteth doo man wittes let v make profit god ſend v ſo hard temptation driuen laſt caſt ſo wee let v thinke ſtraunge bee firſte haue bene ſo ſerued dauid ſheweth v way hee waded like myre god reached hande hee humbled vttermoſt holpe vp agayne vvherefore lette v doubt hee ſtill ſhewe v mercie haue bene hilde downe time see good needefull v haue theſe example eye ſurely make v oure infirmitie ſhall ouermaiſter v temptation fierce vpon v wee knowe become wee wyll bethinke v well ſee ſeruantes god haue bene v although greate giftes grace fayne notwithſtanding grone vnder hande god wiſte become meanes god mente ridde pride teache experience ought ſtoupe vnder pleaſe ſtrike v downe day ſame meane condicionally ende alſo bee lyke notwithſtanding wee ſmarte meane lette mindes bee troubled ſith thing ſhall turne oure profite welfare lo wee haue note cōcerning doctrine conteyned iob addeth god pincheth ſuche wiſe ſhoulde ſeeme intended rend peeces ſaying ſo betokeneth haue ſeene heeretofore namely afflicted bodie alſo touched greateſt foreſt temptation could yea bitter one wit hee tormented inwardly bicauſe god mortall enemie certeſſe ſayth leanneſſe body withering witneſſe god wrath full wrinckles ſo fleſh good halfe rotten alreadie heerein man may ſee token dreadfull affliction god handleth cōmonly wont handle thoſe whome hee chaſtizeth roddes payne exceſsiue therfore effect matter iob intended expreſſe heere wee haue note god ment giue v lookingglaſſes ſuche haue excellent vertues ende theyr perſones might learne knowe according hee dealeth foorth giftes holy ſpirite thereafter alſo doth hee ſende greate affliction themſelues trying chaſtyzing vttermoſte intente make eſteemed bring foorthe fruite example looke vpon abraham gouerned god ſpirite common perſone angell full excellencie perfection mighte bee yet howe god deale wee indure tenth part combattes abraham ſuſteyned ouercame thing vvee woulde quyte quayle god ſpareth v bycauſe hee hath gyuen v ſo excellent giftes hee gaue muche bee ſayde dauid beholde dauid onely god prophet alſo king gouerned holy chozen people ſuch vertues well woorthie renowme prayſe yea euen woonderment yet howe god turmoyle vve ſee complayntes maketh onely deſpyzed ſhaken perſone alſo ſaying god hilde heere earth vpon racke ſo hee forced ſhewe extremitie hee come vnto without cauſe hee ſo often ſayeth paſſed fire water hee bene plunged deepe gulfes hee felte god dartes hee god arrowes ſhotte hand god hath lyen heauy vpon verie bone bene broken remayned nother marye ſubſtance vvhen wee heare theſe kinde ſpeeches ſeeme v bee mockerie god purpoſed ſet v foorth liuely picture according whiche haue ſayde wee might knowe god giueth greate vertues vnto men ſo dothe hee exerciſe liuely intent thoſe vertues ſhould idle ſhould bee knowne due time place beſides let v marke way chiefeſt temptation euer faythfull endured theſe ſpirituall battels wee terme witte god ſummoned conſciences ſo made feele wrath ſmyting ſuche wiſe wiſt cace ſtood pludged deeper diſtreſſe bodily aduerſities could befall heere yee ſee alſo iob vſeth ſimilitude god grated teeth alſo ſee ezechias ſpeaketh bycauſe paſſed ſame temptation god ſayth hath played lyon likewiſe vſed ſame ſimilitude afore hee vſeth heere namely hee wiſt whither might ſpeake hold peace ſayth like swallowe chatter chirpe want wordes vtter griefe miſerie haue toung deliuer herevpon hee commeth afterwarde ſhewe god hathe craſſhed broken bone lyon holdeth pawes teeth howe god bee likened lyon ſo cruell beaſt ezechias mente accuſe god crueltie ſpeaketh owne feeling terrible payne hee endured god wrath vpon lette v marke poore creature entereth doubting cace hee god perceyueth god make feele goodneſſe muſt needes bee ſo greate diſtreſſe ſo afflighted betweene wolues pawes vvee muſt imagine bee ſmall thing man feele god wrath eſpecially conceiue hee vtterly againſt v therefore let v praye god hold v vp ſpare v knowing wee bee able beare ſuch burthen except giue v ſhoulders withall beſides lette v praye vſe ſuch rigour againſt v might feele like lyon rather ſhewe ſelfe continuall father puniſh v deſertes make v alwayes feele mercie meanes lord ieſus chriſt end hath guyded v life holie ſpirite may lift v vp euerlaſting glorie angel hath purchaſed ſo deerely v nowe let v caſt ſelues flat face good god father acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele ſuch wiſe beeing touched true repentance wee maye returne vnto knowing fauourable v wee haue deſired forgiue v ſinnes let v alſo beſeech ridde v fleſhly vice correcting ſinfulneſſe nature bring v perfection life guyded world holie ſpirite wee may glorifie name ſerue earneſt zeale dedicating ſelues wholly vnto according hee hath prouoked v goodneſſe may pleaſe c lxiij sermon ſecond vpon xvj chapter 10 open mouthe againſt giue mee buffet vvaye reproch gather themſelues gither againſt 11 god hath put handes malicious hath diſmayde vvicked 12 proſpered threvve dovvne hee hath caught mee necke ſet butte himſelfe 13 archer hem ſides ſlitteth reines ſpareth poureth gall vpon ground 14 hath broken vvith breaking vpon breaking hath runne ouer gyant 15 haue ſovved ſackcloth vpon skin loden glorie vvith duſt 16 face vvexed blevve vvith vveeping mine eyeliddes couered vvith ſhadovve death 17 yet guile handes praier pure verie greeuous hard thing mortall man god ſetteth himſelfe againſte maketh feele aduerſarie man conceiue howe greate miſerie onely experience cauſe iob vſed ſimilitude lyon ſaw afore ſaid rent piece deuoured god lion maner king ezechias alſo ſpeaketh haue ſayd alredy accuſe god crueltie bicauſe anguiſhe wretched ſinners ſuffer god purſueth cannot expreſſed ſufficiently requiſite ſhould put mynd theſe thing end god touch v quicke may ſo diſmaied feare may conſider faithful haue liued v haue paſſed ſame way god hathe deliuered intente wee ceaſſe call vpon alwayes feared leaſt ſhould plunged ſuch diſpayre wee could call vpon god finde helpe let v marke poore creature maner drowned god maketh feele wrath yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt ſtill flee vnto ſuch diſtreſſe propertie draw men graues heale woundes hee hath made yea euen rayſe v vp death iob complayneth heere another temptation wicked haue opened mouth mocke haue buffeted waye reproche haue aſsembled togither vvhen men ſet ſelues ſorte againſt v renueth miſerie indure vvhy ſo diuell ſerueth owne turne ſuche ſcoffe v ſpite v ouerthrowe roote vp fayth vtterly poſsible iob ſpeaketh heere expreſſely wicked two conſiderations irkeſomer thing god doth manner giue bridle wicked perſecute child trample vnder feete true good men oughte thinke yet ſeemeth vnreaſonable thing god ſhould giue ſuch libertie deſpiſers maieſtie folke wholly giuen vnto euill faythfull ſhould ſo oppreſſed thus yee ſee one reaſon iob ſpeaketh heere expreſſely malicious ſayth ſelfeſame people labour always bring paſſe may haue truſt god giue ſelues wickedneſſe turne away quite goodneſſe ſee doone lorde ieſus chriſte true mirroure patterne faythfull verely dauid indured like wee ſee hapned sonne god ſame ſure rule v belongeth v ſee wherevnto ſaying iobs referred ouer beſides terrible feare wherin haue ſeene men alſo lifting themſelues vp againſt haue labored driue deſpayre reprochfully buffeted though god caſt vp ſpoyle made reckening lo haue marke effecte written ſakes ſo euer god ſhall ſuffer wicked mocke affliction aduaunce themſelues ſuch rage may ſeeme ſhall vtterly ouerwhelmed may greatly diſmayd iob hath indured like battels yet ſee ende happie god hath ſhewed v perſon haue paſſed many temptation wel able help v ſtill therfore let v truſt reſt vpon grace goodneſſe lo haue marke ſtreine iob ſaith expreſly god hath alſo deliuered hand wicked ſaying wel worthy noted imagin wicked liſt conſider god gyueth bridle ſo farre forth himſelfe liſteth paſſe giueth leaue aboue ſayde deſerueth well noted forepoſſeſſed opinion wicked god hande may take much ſcope liſt god redreſſe come muſt needes bee vtterly ouerthrowne whither ſhall flee ſuccour knowe god holdeth satan whelpes lyam onely ſtirre one finger againſt v alſo intend thinke thing without god ordinance wee flee boldly oft ſo perſecuted aſſuring ſelues remedie hande good diſpoſition alſo wee haue humble ourſelues face wicked might beſtirre themſelues god ſhould meddle woulde neuer come mynde acknowledge correction chaſtizementes god thinke v ſinnes mourne might haue pitie v wee knowe wickeddeſt roddes hee holdeth hande beate v correcte v withall ſhort practize well prophet ſayth ſo wee haue eye hande ſtryketh v ſtones dartes ſtrokes cudgelles hitte v bee verie profitable conſideration v beholde ſtill wee haue marke iob ſayth ſimply wicked ranne vpon god hathe beſieged euen hee himſelfe hathe deliuered addeth oppreſſed extremitie manner ſpeeches hee vſeth tende ende vttered ſayth hee beene beaten downe aſtoniſhed god caught neck • rent piece ſet butte ſhoote archer hemmed ſides hee ſlitte aſunder yea hee broken broken againe hereby iob ſheweth hee come ſuch extremitie affliction impoſsible fynde creature preſſed miſerable hee wee haue ſeene god afflicted well bodie goodes alſo owne wife yee ſee iob might well liken himſelfe marke men ſhoote god ſent ſome one kynd aduerſitie alone digge pitte downe hell caſte deeper afterwarde hee loded ſuche weight impoſsible creature beare greater ſtrength man ſoothly maruel haue ſuch conſtancie notwithſtanding infirmity wee ſee god ſtrengtheneth owne making vtterly inſenſible yet taking feebleneſſe quite away muſte bee fayne acknowledge themſelues ſuch bee witte frayle creature yet meane ſeaſon god releeueth infirmitie ſetteth vp againe bee caſte downe thus yee ſee happened vnto iob nowe way hee ſayth hee clothed himſelfe ſackcloth couered heade duſte hee hypocriſie beſides hee ſayth none theſe thinges beſell miſdeedes robberie ſay hee founde handes prayer pure vvherby hee meeneth hee thinketh affliction ſtrange ſith hee offended god ſuche ſort might deſerue bee ſo handled temptation wee haue ſeene ſo often iob calleth ſtill rememberance nowe let v lay foorth matter particularly apply oure vſe ſimilitude iob vſeth importeth good leſſon ſimilitude god hath ſet white butte hath ſette archer againſte beſette round haue ſuch ſort torn piece gall tumbled vpon ground ſay hee wounded verie heart ſpeaking ſo iob mente expreſſe god afflicted common manner nowe let v looke ſelues wee ſuffer neuer ſo little aduerſitie wee thinke ouer great god keepeth meaſure pitie ſee howe nyce wee bee needeth hold v skirmiſh vttermoſt long making ſome moane might thought part febleneſſe mē make ſuch ſtir lift vp themſelues againſt god common aduerſitie haue abide ouergreat impaciencie ſigne wee neuer god ſchoole learne ſuffer yeeld obedience end may learne ſtrong indure chaſtizementes god ſendeth v let v beare mynde ſhewed v heere namely iob ſo excellent holineſſe whome god loued ſo well neuertheleſſe ſet vp white ſhoote told muſt ſtrong affliction harden ſelues againſte god chawe vpon brydle wee ſee many men doe maketh men hardharted ſuffereth brought repentance therefore muſt tender harted behalfe wit ſoone god ticketh v muſt ſtreitways awake thinke vpon tarie till drawe ſword v wound v till lette arrowes flee v thunder vpon v vvhat ſoone giueth v one ſtripe rodde although ſoftly wee muſt bee quiet verely wee wiſe well aduiſed wee would tarrie till ſhould ſtrike ſo much one ſtroke would warned threatnings hie v apace come home touched v yee ſee expedient profitable faythfull ſhuld feele god hand hard againſt ſtrokes horſe dull vpon ſpurre men like better menne thinke good propertie vice euen ſo v though god ſtrike v ſword onely ſhewe v ſhadowe rodde yet muſt moued yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt therwithal bee ſtrong ſuch wiſe haue told muſt heart ſo ouerſorowfull griefe might aſſuaged haue feeling god gracious goodneſſe ſo preſſed cānot mean reclaime thē ſelues bycauſe take conceit god aduerſarie ſo haue truſt al goodneſſe impoſsible ſhuld come neere rather flee frō whē gone away ſtil labor draw therfore muſt plucke vp good hart aduerſities may call vpon god afrayde returne vnto truſting readie ſhewe v mercie wee ſeeke good pure rightmeening mynde ye ſee wherevnto word haue touched tende namely wee muſt bee nyce affliction rather feele time may returne vnto god alſo god hauing ſent v aduerſitie double ſame may griped exceedingly within without yet lette v aſſure ſelues yet come iob therfore continued call vpon god flee ſtill vnto refuge v turne away frō thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſentence nowe whereas heere mention made god archer notable ſimilitude wee ſe howe men alwayes troubled come affliction preſent life wee father vpon god wee ought doe wee imagine alwayes come miſfortune elſe meanes men bee ſhort wee iudge diſorderly ſhape ſelues vnto god cauſe holie scripture beſides telleth v life death light darkeneſſe good euill god hande vſeth alſo familiar cō pariſons ende matter may expreſſed v better according ſayde heere god ſet archer aray againſt iob speakes hee heere men miſeries iob indure theſe miſeries termed god archer ende ſhoulde learne god afflicteth v hee commeth well furniſhed iudge ſhould haue officer come ſtrong companie apprehende malefactor yee ſee god vſeth aduerſities feele preſent life therfore let v thinke miſfortune ſome indure ſickeneſſe ſome pouertie lyke aduerſities worlde numberleſſe ſo lette v aſſure oure ſelues god hathe innumerable meanes correct v liſteth howe liſteth moyſes meeneth hee ſayth thoſe thing locked vppe god cofers hee hath ſpoken miſeries happen man hee addeth cofers ſhould ſay haue treaſurers good thinges pleaſeth mee ſhewe fauoure loue towardes men yea haue wherewith good manner world meanes incomprehenſible contrarie part alſo liſt puniſhe men ſhall feele howe doe wiſt euer knewe thus yee ſee howe god haue incomprehenſible ryches knowne vntoo v well voutſauing poure benefites vpon v alſo contrarie vvherefore let v ſure ſo euer pleaſeth plague v hee doe ſtraunge manner vvell wee ſcaped one miſerie ſecond followe yea innumerable come one another lo haue remember verſe furthermore whereas iob addeth newe gall poured vpon grounde kidneyes open ſhredde piece lette v beare mynde haue touched afore witte god puniſheth purſueth v extremitie hand becommeth ſo grieuous ouerheauie beare wee muſte therefore bee muche diſcouraged dulled lette v beethinke v whiche iob knewe ſo muche wee haue doe god lette v ſighe grone humilitie according alſo hee himſelfe addeth ſaying eye face blubbered weeping hee hadde ſowed ſackclothe vppon skinne hee couered heade duste vvhat ledde iob doe ſo verely bycauſe knewe god hande vpon miſeries light vpon none came fortune god viſitation iob bene perſuaded booted hym haue put ſackcloth vpon backe next skinne haue caſt duſt vpon heade true whiche thinke vpon god fayle make great complaynts weepe howle weare ſackcloth aright ſhall neuer except haue eye vnto god way although hypocrite knowe god aright yet haue ſome conceit whē ſhewe ſuch ſignes repentance true ſaw within ſhould finde nothing fainedneſſe neuertheleſſe ceremonie whereof iob ſpeaketh ſure ſigne men informed confeſſe god iudge muche iob vnfaynedly ſay hee benummed theſe vnbeleeuers god handle thing roughly thinke themſelues see miſfortune hapned looke iob ſo knewe fully reſolued behoued impute thoſe thing vnto god learned leſſon profited wel one day meene learned practize throughly ought moſt men well inough confeſſe diſeaſes deathes miſeries warres plague famine ſuche thing come god come proofe bee amazed able make concluſion ſay ourſelues vvell ſeeing god viſiteth v cō meth home vnto v behoueth v nowe returne vnto heretofore haue played looce coltes haue wilfully run aſtray nowe rayneth v rough bit hee ſhaketh rodde v yea maketh v feele therefore wee muſt learne ſtoupe vnder hande contrariwiſe howe deale wee behalfe man bee afflicted poynte wil elſe chafe grind teeth grudging againſt god surely man tell hath offended god eaſily graunt true hath true remorſe reſtreine himſelfe ſayd haue confuſed conceit hereby man maye ſee fewe haue leſſon well printed hearte affliction god archer garded ſhew himſelf iudge much ſayd ordinarie aduerſities happen commonly people whole countrie touched warre according pollings extorcions outrage doone howe many men thinke vpon god vve ſee rore yet wee conſider god guydeth ſterne vvhen ſee ſuch turmoyling wee admoniſhed marke note ſo muche textes holie scripture wherein god ſheweth v looking glaſſe rather liuely picture ſide ſoeuer men afflicted becommeth acknowledge ſame bee hande god ſpecially whole coūtrie plagued muſt acknowledged god viſitation vvherfore ſuch thing hapneth let v follow example iob wee haue wepte yea euen till oure face bee formeygred teares wee muſte come confeſſe faultes deſire god pitie v ſayde afore vnbeleeuers alſo weepe behoueth v ſet ſelues vnto god doubt make account teares according alſo heare dauid ſaith god putteth bottle vvhen bee ſcourged wee lette v flee ſuccour god weepe ſo true lowlineſſe ſurely ther ſhall one teare droppe eye ſhall come bee accounted preſence ſacrifices euerychone according alſo ſaide one fyftith pſalme ſorrowfull hearte hearte caſt downe pleaſant ſacrifice vnto god teares tende ende witneſſes fleeing vnto god lowlyneſſe acknowledging ſo much hand againſt v none remedie beſeech mercifull v certayne ſayde make account teares ſpecially wee troubled wicked men inſteade making two diuels one ſay wit ſteade rendering euill euill come beſeech god aſſuage hande ſet order thing confuzed let v aſſure oureſelues lyke hee put vp dauids teares intoo bottle ſo hee ſhall loſt though fall grounde god meene neuer forget yee ſee howe muſt applie doctrine owne inſtruction wit wee weepe god afflicteth v oure teares muſt bee teares ſillie witleſſe folke knowe themſelues meene wherevnto ought directe themſelues wee muſt directe ſelues vnto god mourne confyrmed iob ſayth hee clothed himſelfe ſackcloth couered heade duſt surely theſe thing ſignes repentance like wretched offender ſue grace hee cloth himſelfe wedding apparell hee come combed friſled brauerie iudge hee rather come ſo hee maye moue compaſsion ſaye hee come ſorrowfull heauie countenance hee come courſly apparelled mourner ſo faithful haue outward ſignes repentance god afflicted haue confeſſed ſinnes might obteine forgiueneſſe wont cloth ſelues hayre ſackcloth caſt duſt vpon heades ſo dooing allowed god vvhy ſo firſte men neede quicken vp themſelues bycauſe ſlowe colde therefore take conuenient helpe ſpurre ſelues forwarde ſuperfluous ſyth wee knowe commeth humbling ſelues god go ſo lazily faſhions ſake vvee well ſay wee bee faultie wee well caſt foorth ſome ſighes meane ſeaſon wee conſider offence number infinite exceſsiuely great wee ought right diſmayd feare death wee come oure iudge neuertheleſſe ſeeming ynough caſt foorth ſigh twaine away seeing ſuch coldneſſe v lette v aſſure ſelues wee haue neede ſpurred lyke aſſes lo wherevnto ſackcloth duſt auncient father ſerued vſed ſayde ceremonie nought alſo behooueth v come vnto god wee caſt duſt vpon oure heades bodie created like muſt haue heart ſettled vpon god ſo muſt oure body alſo bee anſwerable therevnto whole man muſt dedicated vnto god homage nowe wee ſee theſe thing fond trifle auncient father ware haire sackcloth backes therewithall alſo caſt duſt vpon heades iob ment ſpeaking ſo neuertheleſſe prophete ioell ſayth rende heartes garmentes meaning reiecte thoſe outward ſignes directeth talke hypocrite thought themſelues well diſcharged playde fewe ape toyes men made goodly ſhew ſo might ſeeme well ſeaſoned repentance yea ſayth hee garmentes beare good recorde yee make many bragges ſhewe ſelues good penitent hart continue ſtill ſtubborne naughtineſſe harde stithies thing ought haue begonne furthermore notwithſtanding hee ſayth people take ſackcloth aſhes caſt themſelues vpon ground weepe god gouernours ſuch haue publike charge begin reſt people follow ſée auncient father vſed ſackcloth duſte came open witneſsing repentance god true nowe adayes wee bee tyed bound ſuche manner doings neuertheleſſe repentance ſuch ought wee would bee frozenharted neceſsities haue alledged found v alſo men olde time willing ſpurre vp themſelues knowledge owne ſinnes putting ſackcloth backes praye ſhall become v haue ſuch ſo feruent zeale craue pardon god wee ſo pulled downe miſlike offence ſorie requiſite ala much behoof wee bee dull behalfe auncient father needed humble ſelues acknowledging ſinnes much neede doe vve thinke whit thereby ſeene skil neither god iudgement owne ſinnes true ſinnes may perchaunce well ynough knowne v perceyue owne filthineſſe bee aſhamed bee grieued ſelues part care hearken yet notwithſtanding written vaine let v learne v afflicted although ware ſackcloth ne caſt duſt vpon heade yet ought much ſtirre vp ſelues meanes ſee meete v vvhen man ſelfe alone let bethinke himſelfe thus well pray god ſo hartily ſhould doe let aduiſe himſelfe ſuche meane good mee caſt ſelfe vpon earth lay mouth duſt beeing abaſhed aſhamed god ſhoulde touch mee neerely quicke ſhould prouoked flee god ſuccour beholde ſay howe euerie man ought prouoke himſelfe particularly ſpecially neede conſtreyneth v wee ſee wee haue great neede preſently alſo let v ſtirre vp ſelues togither ſoone god ſendeth plague famine thinke wee ſhould bee pleaſant ſacrifize men made ſolemne proteſtation great ſmall confeſſed ſinnes euerie man ſtirred vp neighbour doe ſame contrariwiſe come bolt vpright ſeemeth wee perceiue god chaſtizements giue ſlip doe wee wonder hee double blowes yea puniſhe v ſeuen folde ſayde lawe vvee haue skill inough chafe demaund wherefore preſſeth v ſo ſore yea wee conſider hee went meeken v beate backe blowes ſuch pryde ſturdineſſe fayne neceſsitie double let v bethinke v practize better leſſon ſhewed v iob furthermore let v marke well ſayth concluſion witte extorcion robberie hand prayer bene pure iob addeth ſayde ſignifie ſuche manner affliction ſtraunge ſo hath ſpoken heeretofore ſurely ſo euer god afflicteth v beholde wee muſt wee muſt enter ſelues examine owne liues therevpon according wee haue offended ſo muſt lament god ſay ala lorde thou afflicteſt ſore deed compare fault wey ballance aduerſitie indure ala lorde knowe haue offended thee ſo many wayes thou ſhouldeſt plunge euen hell well worthie lo haue doe perceiue god afflicteth v ſinnes verie ſore temptation v fall reaſoning oure ſelues howe nowe vvhat haue treſpaſſed vvherefore doth god handle ſo rigorouſly ſee ſpareth wicked haue indeuered ſerue good vpright conſcience deede come farre ſhort diſcharging dutie throughly yet haue euer kept forwarde yet notwithſtanding vſed vnhappieſt curſe dſt creature earth beareth ment geere ye ſee great temptation ſuch one able diſmaye v according befell iob bee done behalfe firſt let v well aduiſed wee may like iob ſo wee may ſay extortion oure handes eaſie matter man vaunte bragge ſoundneſſe wee ſee wickedd eſt ſort aſhamed nowe adayes man admoniſheth miſdoings nothing perfection diueliſheſt would eſteemed halfe angel ſayd let v part ſerch throughly v without flatterie let v proteſt wee haue cleane handes except wee bee throughly like vnto iob performance muſt owne iudges iudge owne fancy manner men ought examine oure liues fourme ſhoulde frame inditement muſt ſaying weene ſuppoſe take ſo weene ſtuffe muſt layde away vvhat let v come god lawe praye inlighten v holie ſpirite may throughly ſerch owne darkneſſe ſinnes v terrible lurkingholes god therefore muſte bee fayne light v vp creſſet giue v wiſedome diſcretion knowe vnderſtande faultes ſuche wiſe wee may confeſſe thus yee ſee wee haue doe let v put cace god handling v ſo oure ſinnes good ſooth hee mente ſuche thing towardes iob puniſhe deſertes vvherefore hee hee intended trie pacience god may afflicte good men euill according wee ſee ezechiell indured much wickeddeſt ieruſalem vvherein god ſpeciall eye ſinnes howbeeit although god puniſhe v according ſinnes yet much ſay hee may doe liſt ſhould bee ſcourged hundred tymes iob god would ſend v ſorer aduerſities hee ſent yet ſhould v wrōg thus yee ſee wee haue marke therewithall behooueth v knowe ſo god executeth iudgementes concealed kept v time beholde ſometimes hee chaſtizeth v ſeemeth hee minded deſtroye v yet hee doth welfare true wee knowe preſently wee ſhall knowe diſcoureth hidden againe iob handled ſo roughly notwithſtanding pure cleane handes appeere proteſtations wee ſhall heare make heereafter praye ought wee wonder nowe adayes god afflict v ſay v haue rebelled againſt ſo many wayes let euery v little bethinke himſelfe ſhall finde wee haue committed ſo many iniquity offence horrible god afflicteth v manner hee iob hee beareth v great deale giueth v ſtripe twaine rodde put cace ſtrake v great blowes ſword yet ſtrokes deadly ſeeing ſayde iob handled ſo rigorouſly notwithſtanding hys handes cleare prayer right god let v learne worlde plagued ſame ſorte cauſe ſhould wonder vvhy ſo wee ſure iniquitie water floud euery man feeleth particularly himſelfe ſo wee v infected vice common ſay hath walked ſo vprightly hee may truely proteſt handes bee cleare god ala commeth farre ſhort ſeeing ſo let v ſure whenſoeuer indure affliction ſame god puniſhment ſinnes therefore wee may beare paciently let v aſſure ſelues haue deſerued much neuertheleſſe let v bee bolde flee vnto god praying voutſafe clenze v vnrightuouſneſſe cauſe miſeries wee endure preſent life maye pleaſe beare infirmity make v feele goodneſſe ende wee may alwayes haue occaſion glorifie euen vntill haue diſpatched v flightfull life make v partaker euerlaſting glorie nowe let v fall downe preſence oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v knowe ſuch wiſe ſo farre foorth expedient v therewithall hee comforte v goodneſſe ſo reforme v holie ſpirit wee may neede bee perſecuted roughly hand aſſoone giueth inckling may bee throughly moued humble oure ſelues vnder maye pleaſe accepte prayer ſelues alſo al thoſe haue need theſe dayes according wee ſee howe ſore whole wretched worlde plagued vvherefore let v beſeech good god looke vpon eye pitie reaſon ſpreading mercie vpon v vpon nation earth wee may haue occaſion ſound forth prayſes euery ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe c lxiiij sermon third vpon xvj chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon xvij verſe vpon text followeth 18 earth hide thou bloud neither let place cry 19 euen novve vvitneſſe heauen vvarrant eth higheſt place 20 friendes rhetorician againſt myne eye poure teares vnto god 21 vvere lavvfull man reaſon vvith god vvith ſonne man neighbor 22 beholde ſhort yeares ſhall ſlide avvaye enter vvaye vvhich ſhall come backe againe iob intending make proteſtation hys owne vpryghtneſſe ſetteth downe heere twoo thinges witte hee hath delte amiſſe towards men hee hathe called vpon god purely referring life lawe bicauſe lorde ſheweth howe wee muſte ſerue howe wee muſte bee conuerſant among men inſomuch often ſpoken without cauſe ſmall matter bee able guide life ſuche wiſe maye pleaſe god vve ſee iobs intent namely ſhew indeuered ſerue god walk neighbour without hurting annoying bodie true heere hee ſetteth downe two particular howbeit meening comprehende whole hee ſayth outrage exceſſe handes importeth muche liued withoute giuing man cauſe complayne ſhoulde ſay hee procured harme loſſe true wee may doe ſome wrong iniurie without ſhew violence much men giue themſelues harmefulneſſe ſtarte boundes ſtreyne themſelues racke one pill another deuour third therefore iob purpoſely ſayeth beene rauening handes much ment ſeconde ſaying ſeruing god conſiſteth exerciſe prayer ſo much chief point vnder particular iob hath comprehended whole nowe wee ſee ſorte life may bee allowable afore god witte duely referred lawe god haue men liue owne ſwinge delight thinke beſt themſelues owne iudges hee himſelfe haue whole authoritie ouer v wee ſhould gouerned according word ende wee labour vaine let v learne walke according god commaundement marke one poynte verely oftentimes ſhewed v yet wee ſee howe worlde doth alwayes runne aſtraye men delight much owne fancy therefore without cauſe holie scripture doth ſo often ſende v poynt wee ſhould liue owne liking according god hath commaunded againe whereas vnder worde prayer heere mention made whole ſeruice god wee ought weye ſame throughly moſt part men thinke al praying vnto god wee ſee howe world diſchargeth ſelfe verie lightly neuertheleſſe scripture ſpeaketh honouring god chiefeſt poynte ſetteth downe v prayer bene obſerued ought bee manner praying bene much eſteemed among men ſo would haue ſwarued one waye haue followed holie scripture ſheweth nowe cleane contrariwiſe come paſſe men haue taken ſuch ſcope praying vntoo god reckening made knowing good profytable bee prayed maner euerie man ſteppes like blinde bayarde commes duetifully vntoo god whence proceedeth ouerweenyng bycauſe wee take prayer bee thing ſo great eſtimation wee tooke cheefe poynte god seruice certayne wee woulde go farre greater heartineſſe againe wee ſee ſteade praying vnto god menne giuen praying sainctes deceaſed worlde yeeldeth thing creature peculiar vnto god thinketh ſame bee otherwyſe good man aske papiſtes terme virgin marie hope ſaluation flee hir euery one hath ſeuerall saincte patrone man tell blaſphemie againſt god verie hard make beleue ſo bicauſe neuer knewe taſted holie scripture vttereth ſo diligently wit ſerue god aright behooueth v praye vnto surely greateſt honorableſt ſeruice requireth v greateſt ſoueraineſt worſhip alloweth v haue oure recourſe vntoo papiſts conſidered would haue yrked haue gone deade creature ſay worſhip god rather yeelde due prayer principall ſeruice requireth oure handes yet conuey ſame ouer creature peruerting order nature much better therefore ought wee marke throughly conteyned wit word prayer iob ment ſhewe ſerued god purely ſo men nowe giue proofe vprightneſſe let alledge gewgawes hypocrite wont doe ſaying haue wee faſted haue wee done wee muſte vnderſtande lorde haue v ruled lawe hee haue whole authoritie ouer v marke one poynt furthermore wee haue alſo note prayer ſhall neuer bee pure god acceptable vnto vnleſſe handes bee cleere violence wee bee cruell wrangling neighbor god putteth v backe haue acceſſe vnto true many giue aduenture pray vnto god although full rauening haue troubled one tormented yet ceaſſe bee hardie ynough call vpon god ſurely prayer abhominable bycauſe handes ſtayned bloude ſay wicked doings heere yee ſee alſo god complayneth prophet eſay iewes came weare pauement temple ſo hee mocketh meening hee liketh comming temple making reſemblance though ment worſhippe ſayth handes full bloud ſay ye haue ceaſſed anoy hurt neighbor nowe thinke giue acceſſe haue acquaintance thus yee ſee effecte haue conſider ſentence nowe iob addeth earth byde bloude neither let teares take place haue miſinterpreted ſentence earth bideth bloud vnderſtood iob ſhould wiſh haue miſeries knowne much hee afflicted ſo exceſsiue faſhion hee deſired bloude might hidden earth might crie vengeance purpoſe plagued men ment earth ſhould aske vengeance againſt god againe otherſide texte declareth ſelfe anon needes muſt man ſhet owne eye ouerſeene ſo eaſie matter iob heere toucheth two point one theſe word earth hide blud theſe neither let cry take place vvhat meeneth hee wiſhing cryes ſhould take place muche ſay hee hathe ouerlaboured himſelfe cry turmoyling ſhall bee laboure loſt bycauſe god refuſeth hee come men ſhall gayne nothing syth cace ſtandeth ſo wee maye eaſily conclude ſaying earth hide bloude graunteth haue done amiſſe matter ſhall come account iudgement whole life ſhall bee layde afore inditement ſhall bee framed extremitie god handle according deſerts doubtleſſe holy scripture worde bloude oftentimes taken horrible crime example lorde deliuer bloude ſaye lorde deliuer mee deadly ſinnes haue commited vvherfore wee ſee iob place termeth trāſgreſsions crime hee might haue committed name bloud according matter ſayde handes cleere rauin confirmation thereof hee addeth god finde guiltie thing whatſoeuer hee contented ſame ſhall come light account ſinnes ſhould bee longer concealed god ſhoulde bring abroade throughly examined hee bee found faultie hee contented god ſhould ſhewe fauoure mercie afterward hee ſayth although hee ſighe ſhreeke yet notwithſtanding let boote let al outcry loſt ſo may ſeeme god eares ſtopped ſee iobs meening heere haue call mynde thing hath beene treated afore iobs raging bycauſe hee looketh god ſoueraine iuſtice whiche ſo perfecte exquiſite creature able ſtande euen angelles hath beene ſayde heeretofore iob looked well vpon would haue hilde awe ſo ſhould neuer haue made ſuche proteſtations moreouer wee muſt call remembrance iobs intent iuſtifie himſelfe though hee vtterly innocent loketh reſpect god ſhould puniſh deſerued men commonly puniſhed miſdeeds alſo god another reſpect wit ment ſet forth mirrour men trie pacience iob meeneth declare heere life wholly pure neuer done amiſſe meening god puniſheth rigorouſly wicked caytife led licencious life men lo heere effect haue beare away v let v aſſure ſelues god plague v ſinnes although conſcience witneſſed wee deſire ſerue honour yea euen without hypocriſie yet notwithſtanding ſhall come farre ſhort beeing ſo cleare ought bee wee ſhould bee found indaungered hundred thouſand wayes therefore let euery man looke neerely himſelf whē know fault beſt let v ſure god knoweth hundred time v ſelues knowe ſome one fault god ſharpe ſighted ſayth sainte iohn canonicall epiſtle let v learne humble oure ſelues beſeech god hide faultes behoueth v come backe ſayde two thirtie pſalme namely bleſſed man whoſe ſinnes lorde couereth whoſe iniquity hee calleth remembrance god diſcouer oure faultes muſt v periſhe yea euen perfecteſt onely refuge welfare praye vnto god hide tranſgreſsions maye come account intende iudge ſhift hell muſt prepared v furthermore let v deſire god hearken cry vnworthy though bee god delay graunting requeſtes till wee haue ſerued perfection ala ſhall become v ſhall one gate ſhall bee ſhet againſt ſo hee ſhall haue entrance vnto god cry therfore muſt receiued notwithſtanding haue deſerued ſhaken neuertheleſſe behoueth v doe indeuer liue quietly neighbor may haue god fauour finde ſuch one towards v deſire vvhy ſo written iudgement without mercie ſhall haue hath bene mercileſſe ye ſee saint iames telleth v god deale rigorouſly v haue pittie compaſsion vpon neighbor heere vvhat thing betide v ſo dreadfull god handleth v rigorouſly contrariwiſe hope v conceyue god vſing infinite goodneſſe ſheweth imputing ſinnes v againe salomon ſayth hee ſtoppeth eare cry poore ſhall cry himſelfe heard neighbour aduerſitie deſire ayde yetnotwithſtanding deafe ſo ſhake yea worſe alſo torment needes muſt feele vengeance god ſhall make v crie yea bring v ſuch deale wote become yet ſhall hearken v therefore haue ſayd alreadie wee haue god mercifull v let v beware haue compaſsion ſuch aduerſitie ſuccor let v kepe ſelues crueltie outrage leaſt thing written performed vpō v ſame meaſure ſhall moten v wee mote neighbour thus ye ſee effect haue marke ſentence followeth immediately alſo ſee witneſſes heauen hee warranteth mee highest place friend play orator againſt mine eye guſh teares vnto god heere iob appealeth vnto god onely competent iudge bicauſe hee bene wrongfully condemned men doubteth appeale vnto god much hee knowes cace good true haue ſaid already miſſehandleth cace howe ſo hee iuſt cauſe mainteine ſoundneſſe ye ſee cauſe afrayde appeale vnto god ſeeth men perſecute wrongfully let v conſider one iob intent vſe ſuch raſh boldneſſe moſt men vvhen matter commeth calling god witneſſe pray maketh curſie conſcience world adays full forſwearing ther faithfulneſſe vvhereof cōmes bicauſe haue feeling god iuſtice come ruſhing againſt ſeate like wilde beaſtes periurie forſwearing ſpiting god though hee neither might authoritie puniſhe v vve denie ſo wee call god bee oure witneſſe iudge hee therefore ſweareth falſely doth mocke god maieſtie face yet ſee men make much account apparant hereby wee beare ſmall reuerence maieſtie god vvherefore ſo muche oughte wee marke whiche ſayde namely wee muſte bee ſo bolde proteſting god calling recorde wee muſte goe wee poynt yeelde accounte ſame maner iob ſummoned haue ſeene heretofore ſhall ſee yet fully hereafter nowadays man bee accuſed crime althoughe taken tardie yea vtterly conuinced yet hee make conſcience ſaye god witneſſe wronged falſely accuſed howe happeneth god name ſo ryfe mennes mouthes alſo hypocrite magnifye ſelues alwayes ſaye god priuie hearte knoweth referre cace hym happeneth doe wee thinke bycauſe god wynketh menne call ſo recorde falſe ſtandarde larum puniſheth thoſe firſte daſhe whiche doe ſo dallie therefore hee lengthe ſhewe whiche hee hath vttered lawe witte hee ſuffer name taken ſo vaine reuendge wrong doone offering ſo great reproch ſcorne maieſtie ſorte lette v marke well ofte muſte come god behoueth v haue examined oure lyfe example iob wee bee ſo raſhe ſteppe foorth ſaye god witneſſe wee haue thoroughly ſerched oure conſciences god anſwere within v hee alloweth marke one poynte heerewithall wee haue marke worlde beare v recorde nothyng till god haue allowed hereby wee bee warned diſpoſe lyfe fayre outewarde ſhewe wee ſee howe nothing vayngloriouſneſſe alwayes worlde men clappe handes v wee bee good eſtimation among ynough v wee woulde fayne god ſhould content himſelfe yea hee lyke mortall men holye scripture ſheweth vvee ſee outwarde appearance god ſearcheth hidden within hath eye truth vprightneſſe ſpeaketh prophete hieremie accordingly texte samuell seeing ſo let v learne knowe behoueth v haue oure handes oure eye feete cleane neyther muſt wee thinke ſelues haue doone muche oure ſinnes manifeſte chief poynt haue recorde heauen ſaye god allowe doings haue declared alreadie vvhat manner allowaunce muſt wee haue god verely wee haue walked pureneſſe heart hath bin hypocriſie v wee haue onely ſome outwarde ſhewe ſo wee might ſaye worlde charge wee haue right meening mynde wee haue continued good dooing wee haue indeuered ſo behaue oure ſelues god marked onely woorkes alſo thoughtes marke yet haue beare awaye ſentence beholde ſayth iob euen nowe recorde heauen vnder woorde euen alſo hee comprehendeth may wel take men witneſſe hee paſſeth yet commeth euen vntoo god ought bee weyed whereas hypocrite call god witneſſe dare put themſelues triall menne bee wicked perſone notoriouſly knowne bee ſuche one ſo caſte priſon ſo hee bee drawing gallowes hee brag honeſtie vttermoſte yet meane whyle euerie man wil condemne yea ſteade three foure iudges ſhall haue hundred thouſande euerie man ſaye marke mee yonder naughtypacke marke mee yonder theefe marke yonder murtherer marke yonder extortioner yonder ſwearer yonder extortioner yonder ſwearer yonder deſpizer god yet ſuche manner menne ſo ſhameleſſe make bone take god recorde honeſtie proteſte knoweth bee readie anſwere matter come tryall menne ſhoulde haue thouſande voyces condemne haue touched alreadye howe dare preſent themſelues god bicauſe conceyue maieſtie lo wee oughte weye well thys woorde euen ſayeth iob hee preſuppoſeth hee maye call men recorde euerie man beare witneſſe hee hadde ſo behaued himſelfe hee bene eye blynde gardian fatherleſſe defender widdowes hee ſerued ſtead legges cripple hande neuer bene ſhet poore wee ſee maketh proteſtations afterwarde iob walked ſuche wyſe afore men hee ſayeth hee myghte come euen god alſo whyche greate thing alſo wee ſee howe magnifyeth heere witneſſe heauen well bee coniectured hee flung aduenture iuſtifye himſelfe vnbrideled libertie theſe mocker doe proteſte mouth god knoweth yet life ſo villanous verie ayre ſtinketh verye babe canne skyll ſpeake thus yee ſee wee haue marke texte afterwarde hee addeth freendes playde oratours meane whyle eye poured oute teares afore god iob ſheweth hee fayne referre himſelfe god iudgement namely bycauſe fyndeth reaſon vprightneſſe among men surely verie greate temptation wee bee plagued worlde taketh v bee forſaken god pollicie diuels driue v deſpaire vvhen poore man ſmitten god roddes miſerie indureth heauie inoughe ſelfe nowe one come laye double loade vppon backe caſting teeth howe appeareth plainly hee vtterly forſaken god ynough ouerwhelme ſpeake wicked ſtubborne ſorte whome god plagueth ſinnes ſpeake ſuche haue walked vprightly yet notwithſtanding god hathe miſſed afflict true haue wel deſerued hee hath alwayes eye vnto nowe hee intendeth mortifye tyme come bicauſe yet ſufficiently tamed fayne cut away leude affection furthermore haue learne needfull pray vnto put theyr whole truſt finally wil haue pacience ſhewed thus ye ſee good man tendeth godward walketh playnely ſhall notwithſtandyng haue greate plague nowe proofe god taketh greater ſinner men ſurely yet man ſhould threape vpon inough caſte intoo deſpaire ſo iob delte let v marke well ſayde temptation hard burthenſome therfore let v reſort remedie muſt vſe wit preſente ſelues god without tying ſelues ouermuche vnto men according iob hathe diſcourſed heere afore frendes ſayth play oratours againſte mee meeneth oughte haue comforted partly haue aſſuaged grief haue taken pleſure mocke rhetorike wherof ſpeaketh nothing elſe filed toungs mock vexe put beſides himſelfe hapned vnto iob ende ſhould bee example vnto v therfore whenſoeuer ſhal pleaſe god afflict v world iudge amiſſe v diuers take occaſion condemne v though mynd neuer bene rightly diſpoſed let v take paciently aſſuring ſelues oure lorde ſtirreth vp men ſort agaynſt v satan practiſeth caſt v quite downe ſame parte croſſe wee muſte ſeeke remedie miſchiefe ſuche wyſe iob ſheweth v oure eye muſt poure teares vnto god vvhy ſo vve ſee men come vexe v ſort therfore would encounter driue backe howe doo mee great wrong greate crueltie handle maner true maye well make ſuche proteſtation wee muſt ſtande muche vpon point muſt glaunce yea muſte done ende namely ſorie men ſhould • ake occaſion ſtumbling v intente wee example euill let v ſaye thus beholde although men iudge euill mee yet haue endeuered ſerue god neuertheleſſe conceite muſte glyde away lightly neuer bethink v god iudgementes neyther doe enter intoo owne conſciences ſo long pleade ſort men vve ſee vice bee ouer common therfore let v remember leſſon ſhewed v heere wit eye muſt ſhed teares god lifting vp eye aloft ſee men ſo malicious towards v draw reaſon though eaſie iudge oure life haue doone thing worthie blame lette v learne reſort vnto god content haue warrant thus yee ſee wherevntoo iob leadeth v wee follow example duely heereby alſo ſhewed v plainly wherefore made proteſtations haue heard long ſince ſo complayning ſentence bycauſe men condemned wrongfully let v nowe proceede wiſheth lawfull hym pleade god mortall man doth equall ſayeth ſhort dayes ſlide away enter way whiche ſhall come backe ageyn vvhen iob wiſheth lawfull plead god according whiche wee haue ſeene alreadie hereby ſheweth chafing bicauſe miſerie endured ſo greuous could beare ſo hee amiſſe v accuſe iob point let v haue eye whiche haue ſayde namely good matter yet caried away ouerſhot himſelf handling knowne owne tranſgreſsion fault cōmitted ſubmitted himſelfe quietly god entred intoo pleading faultfinding ſayd afore knew angel clere god ſuch perfect rightuouſneſſe god euer creature bring muſt neceſſitie bee nought worth inſomuch brightneſſe sunne dimme starres much rather muſte god rightuouſneſſe ſwallowe vp rightuouſneſſe ſuppoſe ſelues haue iob therefore ſpake maner well remembred ſaid conſideration god rightuouſneſſe would haue ſo ouerſhot himſelfe ſay would lawfull mee goe lawe god haue touched already albeit knew doctrine yet paſsion ſo vehement forgate himſelf hereby warned ſo beare away thing whiche reade holie scripture wee may learne bridle paſsions wee bee tempted impaciencie anye vice thing wee haue learned god worde may bee ſufficient drawe v trouble riſeth vp againſt v saint paule ſayeth goſpell power ſubdue thing lifte vp themſelues againſte god beholde oure wittes beholde oure fleſhly affection ſee howe lifte vp themſelues agaynſt god bid battell vvhat doone muſt hilde captiuitie ſaye ſoeuer finde v oure nature bee agaynſt god doctrine wee muſt ſubdue force thus yee ſee perfect conſtancie wherein behoueth v continue therefore fall diſputing ſpecially come encountering let v ſhrinke downe meekely lyke ſillie ſheepe let v alwayes conclude god iudge nothing bee found fault withall hym though libertie pleade yet ſhould cace quayle coulde alledge one poynt myſelfe hee woulde alledge thouſande againſte mee yee ſee wee muſte glorifye god without ſtanding contention hym yea euen althoughe lawfull v pleade ſelues heere ye ſee alſo lord purpoſe conuince mē doth ſay go let v go law togither doth cheefly prophet eſay content ſayth go law let v haue iudge vmper let bee tryed hath wrong hath right vvhereof ye accuſe vvhat harme haue done contrariwiſe accuſe ſuche poynts ſuche doubt iudge betweene god v vvhy vſeth ſuche maner ſpeach letteth himſelfe downe maieſtie highneſſe ſheweth hee creature vmper dayeſman appointed ſo hee ſhould bee fayne abyde another bodyes iudgement yet could men cleare themſelues hee alledge agaynſt vve ſee god vſing thys manner ſpeech thoughe mortall man clad perſon ſhew v plagueth v lyke tyrant ne dealeth v abſolute authoritie popiſh diuines haue ſurmized diueliſh doctrine god vſeth ſuche abſolute power ſay lawleſſe power terme whiche ſhould bee ſeparated rightfulneſſe hee vſeth vprightneſſe inſomuche mouthes muſt ſtopped hath condemned v bee founde righteous iudging ſayd one fiftie pſalme true wee haue falſe wrongfull verdites make many allegation againſt ende god ſhall bee founde rightuous yea euen confuzion vvhat remayneth vve muſt humble meeken ſelues acknowledge god iudgements rightfull notwithſtanding vnto v ſeeme contrarie furthermore let v go diminiſh maieſtie neither let v ſay would god mortall man deale match let god maieſtie bee continued ſtill full ſtate lyeth v imbace curſed blaſphemie attempt surely iobs intent blaſpheme hee bin mind satan caried quite cleane away ſayde hee bewrayeth owne paſsions wherevnto conſented firſt moouing cut ſo cōmeth mynde lift vp ourſelues againſt god bycauſe hand ſeemeth lye heauie vpon v let v turne backe reſtreyne vnruly affection aſſuring ſelues god hath iuſt cauſe puniſhe v hundred tymes roughly hee dooth liſted yee ſee wiſe behoueth men humble themſelues acknowledge god bee ſoueraine iudge therewithall fayle take holde mercie aſſuring themſelues inaſmuch welſpring goodneſſe hys maieſtie terrible v looke vpon v pitie knowing oure infirmity beare deede know hath gyuen v good pawne good aſſurance lord ieſus chriſt whome hath made iudge intent might find mercie partie ſheweth himſelfe redeemer aduocate let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god wyth acknowledgement oure ſinnes praying hym make v feele ſuch wiſe aſhamed may flee whither elſe ſuccor mercie may know needeful ſame v therevpon imbrace therwithall alſo let v learne bee diſpleaſed ſelues ſinnes ſo flatter ſelues haue bin wont wee may bee clenzed oure owne filthineſſe clothed ouer wyth hys rightuouſneſſe whiche yet little begonne v may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c lxv sermon firſt vpon xvij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon last verſe xvj chapter vpon text followeth breath vnſauerie dayes ende graues vpon 2 dallyers vvith myne eye abideth bitterneſſe 3 pray thee lay dovvne guage giue pledge thee vvho vvill touch hande 4 bycauſe thou haſt couered theyr hart haue vnderſtanding thou vvilt exalt 5 verely thoſe ſpeake flattery freends eye child ſhall fayle iob made proteſtation innocencie haue ſeene hee addeth ſame booteth hee ſeeth hymſelfe manner forlorne go ſayth hee intoo path whereby ſhall neuer returne agayne anon addeth complaynt ſhortneſſe life meening thereby god ought handle men leſſe rigorouſly ſeeing paſſe away ouer earth afterwarde confirmeth matter new agayne ſaying breath vnſauerie breath quite ſpent hee hath lustineſſe ſo remayneth nothyng graue ſide ſo euer turne ſeeth preſent death hee hemmed round ſo cānot ſcape graue prepared ye ſee effect iob meeneth surely reſpect motherwit could perceiue god minded diſpatch quite cleane might haue loked higher acording know euen extremitie death faithful muſt ſtill hope life ſo cō fort thēſelues tribulation may doubt god giue good end moreouer god onely giueth v wherewith comfort ourſelues oure tribulation alſo whereof glorie triumph aſſuring ourſelues ſame ſhal turne ſaluatiō iob thē ſpeaketh throughly like faithful mā haue ſayd already vttereth paſsions euery one v findeth experiēce himſelf although reſt vpon god promiſes comfort himſelf yet notwithſtanding ceaſſeth diſquieted troubled himſelfe vve ſhall ouercome temptation firſt puſhe muſt fayn fight great force difficultie vvhen wee haue ſuch battell may well ſaye iob ſee nothing graue breath foreſpente liuelyneſſe cut away ther recouerie vve may ſay ſo ought ſee howbeit ſoone haue eſpied oure miſeries felte wee muſt lift vp oure ſelues higher vnto godwarde doubte hee deliuer v yea make thing turne profite whiche wee thinke bee oure harme yee ſee effecte ſort wee muſte practize ſentence wit firſt v ſuche diſtreſſe woteth ſay ne ſeeth ende cace well muſt therfore bee aſtonyed thoughe accordyng fleſhe dread preſent death god ſeeme haue forſaken v helpe v vvee ſee iob came lyke diſtreſſe yet notwithſtandyng hee ceaſſed beleeue god would haue pitie ende hee foughte good whyle neyther doubted hee victorie yee ſee owne feebleneſſe ought bee diſcomfort vntoo v ſoone feele ſuche impedimentes let v caſt eye vpon god ſay well muſt bee fayne paſſe heere thorough pathe whereby neuer man returneth agayne according courſe kind yea hath god promiſed ſeruauntes holde hande middes death yes let v marche boldly againe haue wee ieſus chriſte guyde let v goe death doe wee know howe entrie wherby come glorie heauen seeing reſurrection ioyned deathe god ſonne alſo aſſure v god ſuffer v continue rottenneſſe knowe whiche written ſixteenth pſalme fulfilled namely god preſerued hym rotting ende wee ſhoulde bee made free drawne quite length seeyng wee haue ſuche promiſes goddes hande ſuche aſſuraunce perſone oure lorde ieſus chryſte wee ought fyghte manfully agaynſt dreadfulneſſe death loe effect wee haue remember ſtreyn herewithall wee bee alſo put mynde brittleneſſe lyfe breath forespent ſayeth iob good ſooth luſtineſſe men blaſte agayne lyfe long wee woulde wiſhe yet little ſtart yeares number reſpecte mannes lyfe lyſtyneſſe wee haue thyng ſo withered fadeth awaye seeing ſo let v learne ouerſleepe ſelues heere knowing god ſhewing v howe frayle worlde giueth v occaſion thinke vppon ſeeke heauenly life torment oure ſelues meaſure ſith wee ſee oure lyfe goeth decay little little fadeth vtterly therefore let v bee greeued aſſoone god ſettleth v worlde hee telleth v entent wee ſhoulde paſſe ſwiftely awaye make turne heere though ſeemed life verie ſtrong wiſe miſliked thing whiche wee haue yet remember ſentence alſo bee noted vpon worde graues bee beſieged one kind death many vve haue one life yea ſame verie flightfull conſiſting one blaſt nothing wee looke nerely v whole hundred death beſet v round ſo ye ſee iob vſeth plurall number graues bene ynough haue ſayde graue prepared mee cannot eſcape hee ſayeth graues prepared mee needeth one man anye one pitte iob meeneth ſone neuer ſo little paſſed oute one death another ſhoulde wayte hym yea another bee ſhorte hee ſhoulde bee fayne periſhe thoughe hee paſſed neuer ſo many daungers true wee come intoo ſuche extremity iob yet none v findeth himſelfe ſame cace ſaye hath one lyfe among number deathes readie v vvhat bee doone vve muſt learne praye vntoo oure god betake oure lyfe intoo handes ende wee may bee ſure seeing pleaſeth god keeper oure lyfe lette v walke courſe withoute ouermuche carefulneſſe agayne though thouſande deathes readie ſwallowe v vp god ſtrong ynough plucke v ſayde pſalme hee hath iſſues outegoings death hande ſaye hee hathe meanes whereby deliuer v yea euen althoughe ſame bee incomprehenſible v neuertheleſſe lette v heereby take warning bee alwayes readie departe worlde much wedded beeing heere low ſhoulde wee gayne lette v alwayes haue one foote lyfted vp wee ſhoulde enter intoo graue lette v goe luſtily making concluſion ſelues wee goe thither tarie euer oure lorde hath ſhewed v perſone lord ieſus chriſte hee haue v periſhe death abyde rottenneſſe euer let v proceede ſayde truthe dallyers mee myne eye continueth bitterneſſe heere iob findeth faulte thoſe came comforte nothing elſe put trouble hee termeth dallyers ſcoffe folke aduerſitie bicauſe came iudge affliction compaſsion humanitie ought haue doone ſo hee addeth could bring nothing vexation greeue fayne beholde ſtill miſerie bitterneſſe procured hereby bee aduertiſed wee comforte ſorrowfull afflicted aright muſte come vnkyndely heart ſteele yron wee muſt bee pitiful muſt man thinke himſelfe meete comforte ſuche trouble incomberance except cloth ſelfe paſsions ſay except hee put himſelfe cace true ſuch owne ſeeming ſtouteſt comfort poore folke diſtreſſe ſhall doo ſmall good come tongue breuerie gay word may well diſcourſe matter ſhal purpoſe impoſsible v vſe doctrine ſhall fitte aſſwage greefes neighbour vnleſſe feele touched ourſelues therefore let v marke well word dallyers ſuche churliſhe vnkynde meane comforte thoſe incombered tribulation marke one poynt agayne ſeeing know behoueth v bee pitifull toward ſuch ſuffer miſerie let v bethynke v ſayd pſalme bliſſed man hath conſideration poore god delyuer hym day aduerſitie v wit behoueth v haue ſingular diſcretion iudge aright aduerſities neighbour wee muſte follow ſame diſcrete dealing god ſheweth v giueth vnto v without wee ſhall go cleane contrary worke man plagued ſhall hold talke ouerthwartly without diſcretion thē muſt god giue v vnderſtanding deeme aright folkes affliction heerevpon come comfort ſuch indure aduerſitie ſpecially ſhew faultes let v go ſharpely ſet oure foote vppon throte bee downe rather let v haue mind deſire releeue help vp aboue thing muſt beſeech god giue v ſpirit vnderſtanding ſayd moreouer thing muſt alſo practized wit v trouble muſt haue care apply holy ſcripture ſuch vſe may comforted vvhy ſo bee offended man commeth ſting v heape vp yet trouble vpon v aduerſitie already wee ſoone ſay greate crueltie honeſtie good dealing men handle v ſort yet euery one v lyke hymſelfe auineſſe take holy ſcripture comfort mee bethinke take text ſhould rather meete threatening ſteade ſcripture ſhould make mee feele ſome taſte god goodneſſe comforte hym aſſuage ſorrowes ſet ſelfe fire increace greefe see ouerſhoote ouerſelues bycauſe haue skill cō fort ſelues ought god would wee ſhould therefore let v haue pitie compaſsiō neyghbours aduerſitie alſo let euery v looke hymſelfe comfort aſſuage hys owne ſorrowes aright lighteth ſuch extremitie followeth iob deſireth god lay downe gage giue pledge put ſuretie vvho ſayeth iob touch hand returneth matter declared yeſterday hee woulde fayne go law god yea fellowe hys equall demaundeth hee gage demaundeth hee ſuretie warrantize bycauſe would haue god abace himſelfe maieſtie ſhould ſay surely ſo long thou continueſt thy greatneſſe dare come diſpute againſt thee thou art ouermightie confound mee giue mee leaue talke thee lay downe gage bynd thy ſelfe abyde tryall ſubmit thy ſelfe authoritie iudge cace man dweller place ſhoulde hyre houſe put ſuretyes vvhat iob meeneth ſaying vvho hee touch mee hand muche ſay vndertake bee ſuretie mee men vſed ceremonie like adayes men ſigne paper hand iudge notarie ſo thoſe dayes party touched one another hand gyue theyr fayth bind ſelues yee ſee iobs meening yee would knowe whither demaund bee excuſed deſired god hee myght pleade againſt certayne bee excuſed touched glauncingly yeſterday ought deſire nothing come god haue hym iudge yea ſhould handle v hee liſteth himſelfe true ſhould vtter rigour againſt v ſhift ſhould confounded vvo bee thoſe wretched creature come iudged rigorouſly without mercie foraſmuch god loueth v receyue v forgiueneſſe ſinnes whiche hee offereth v ſheweth hymſelfe bee one v lorde ieſus chriſte pronounceth bliſſed whoſe ſinnes forgiuen heare theſe thing wee wiſh better cace come face taketh away oure ſinnes caſteth behynde hys backe bottome sea ſayde▪ ſpecially let v looke vppon oure lorde ieſus chriſt whome power iudgemente gyuen whiche ſerueth maynteyne cace aduocate thynke wee hee make bitter death auaylable indured v men well aduyzed ought nothing bee wiſhed iudged god hand leaſtwiſe ſo recourſe mercie yeelded themſelues intoo handes lord ieſus chriſt iudge v condemnation rather acquit v behalfe wee may ſay sainct paule god acquitteth v ſhall condemne v vvho ſhall accuſe v ſeeyng ieſus chriſt aduocate defendeth oure cace partie anſwereth v god hys father shall wee feare bee accuſed condemned iob hath vttered hymſelfe heere ſuch wiſe hee founde himſelfe turmoyled hys owne paſsions torment heereby wee bee taught repreſſe oure owne naughtineſſe vvhy ſo wee ſee inordinateneſſe nature wee giue oure affection head whereto muſt come iob deſyreth go law wyth god ala preuayle ſute hee deſireth bee vtterly ouerwhelmed much would doo god reſtreyneth v gyuing v grace ſubdue paſsions let v marke well firſt men ſuffer themſelues bee caried away fleſhly affection ouerſhoote themſelues ſo far become ſo hardharted make bone ruſh againſt god horrible thing mā v abhorreth aduāce himſelf ſort againſt god yet al ſo ordinarie vyce among v vvhat done heerevpon vve muſt learne brydle oure affection ſeeyng ſo furiouſe arme v manner againſt god example ſet afore v end euery v ſhould indeuer repreſſe much v lyeth marke one poynt agayne lette v deſire diminiſh maieſtie god eaſing ſelues hand ouerſtrong ouerheauie vpon v afflicteth v let v aſſure ſelues hee vpholdeth v farre ſtronger mightier puiſſance vvhen lord viſiteth v ſendeth v affliction well wee may ſay heere burthen heauie beare indure ſo feeble let v conſider little meanes wee hold one minute houre able reſiſt manfulneſſe wee oure ſelues warde god blowes hee ſtriketh v wee able outſtand force bycauſe hee ſtriketh v one hand hee holdeth v vp elſe certayne ſhould vndone euery blowe god ſhould neede giue v one fillup ſay make countenance ſtrike v diſpatched hande seeyng ſo v cannot holde god afflicteth v power greate follye v deſyre therevpon mightineſſe ſhould bee abated vvherefore haue ſayde erewhyle let v learne deſire glory ſhould bee diminiſhed eaſing v cleane wrong way wee ſhould bee vtterly diſappoynted deſire thought bee eaſed weakening effeebling god hande next way ſend v packing bycauſe none meane preſerue v onely god vttering ſtrength v haue ſayde afore another poynt whyche wee haue conſider texte therewithall let v marke alſo horrible blaſphemie require god lay v downe gage put v pledge ſuretie likelyhod wee truſt faithfulneſſe true iob vſeth theſe word declare ouerhygh power god mortall man durſt incounter except god would releaſe owne right yet neuertheleſſe god gyueth v aſſurances come vntoo hym vvhich haue men content themſelues ſingle word good reaſon ſhould vvill wee bee aſſured let v giue eare god promiſes let v imbrace let v beleeue hee ment feede v leaſing ſoade v vayne fruteleſſe hope hee faythfull performe hath promiſed thus yee ſee poynt behoueth v come beſides haue good gage lord ieſus chriſt ſee euer god promiſed warranted ſuch time gaue onely ſonne death rayzed vp agayne wee ſee gage ought aſſure v ſufficiently beſides god ſealeth promiſes hart holy ghoſt marke goodly record namely haue lorde himſelf ſpeake end might doubt truthe might boaſt ſelues whatſoeuer conteyned word altogither ſure deceytleſſe vnto v marke ſay marke aſſurances whiche god gyueth v goodes hee putteth handes warrant v pledge aſſurance hee haue v demaund therefore let v learne content ſelues effect haue conſider vpon verſe yet behoueth v turne backe haue touched wit ſeeing lord voutſafeth handle v ſo ſweetly telleth v muſt afraid come face ſo much vnthākfulneſſe v deſire go law muſt man totoo froward refuzeth bee iudged god yes ſith god promiſeth euen vſeth greateſt rigour yet hee forget goodneſſe releeue mainteyne v continually ſhal ſee needfull giue good deſirable end oure affliction muſt needes toto vnkynd refuze ſuche benefite priuiledge way v humble preſent ſelues iudgement ſeate god wee may vphild grace iob addeth bycauſe thou hast couered hart haue vnderstandyng thou wilt exalte heere iob ſtrengtheneth himſelfe againſt thoſe vexed vnder colour comforting haue remember hath bene ſayd namely iob bewrayeth affection ſo woonder though continue one tale ſhift eft one matter eft another ſo ſhewe himſelfe variable wherfore bycauſe ſpeaketh combate vve knowe man fighting combate keepeth alwayes one countenance fayne trauerſe ground fet compaſſe ſhift handes retire auaunce forewarde enimie preaceth vppon himſelfe eſpyeth owne aduauntage euen ſo v wee fall reſiſting temptation sometimes ſtoupe ſaue ſelues ſometymes wee giue backe auoyd blowe god giueth v reſpit ſo take wee hart agayne releeued lykely ſhuld haue bene ouerthrowen thing therefore ſee iob taketh courage ſayth lord true corzie mee ſee freendes become dalyers doo nothing elſe vexe mee yet muſt diſcomfort ſelfe ſee well haue none vnderſtanding therefore muſt take hold ſeeing reaſon beaſt came running vppon mee dogge hild mee bay myght well vſe fayre woordes appeaze could preuayle vnderſtand ô lord muſt take hart heare wandering talke theſe men vvhy ſo bycauſe thou haſt couered hart haue vnderſtanding thys haue touched already namely comfort wretched folke affliction wee muſt deſire god giue v ſpirit wiſdome withall talk ſhall vaine vnprofitable ſauing ſo farre foorth reacheth v hand like contrarie part wee ſhall ſpeake edifying guyde v ſayd couereth hart might haue none vnderſtanding man ſhould ſay hee blyndfoldeth eye ſcripture word hart ſometimes taken mynd deede taken ſo continually ſometimes taken trueneſſe pure conſcience whereas ſayde moyſes god hath giuen hart vnderſtand euē vnto day wee ſee word hart taken mynde euen ſo alſo ſentence iob therefore meeneth god hath blyndfolded eye theſe men heere thought themſelues wiſe thereby became good beaſts let v marke manner men theſe freendes iob euident talke excellent men fooles ſee men experience men great wit yea ſayd god ſent ſhall ſcarſly haue one iote wiſedome ſhall become pleaſeth god blynd agayne god ſo blind wiſe let thoſe thinke themſelues skilfull truſt owne ſharp wit preſume much vpon owne policie learne humble themſelues knowing god ſo blynde eye ſhall ſee whit high nooneday thus ſee yea profitable leſſon ſuch take pride owne wiſedome thinke nothing ought paſſe aduice vvhat ſhall become god ſhall haue blynded thus blynde wretch haue eye ſeeled vp diſcerne nothing ſhall end god exalt ſay hee put ſhame ende bee verified worldly thing ſayd ſecretes heauenlye kingdome farre ſurmount al wit mā behold god blindeth eye wiſe euen worldly affayres thing concerne preſent life inſomuch euen thoſe moſt craftie greateſt wit become like little babe fond deedes readye fall downe euery blowe men ſee cauſe god hath couered eyeſight ſhall wee doo wee muſt fayne mount vp hygher wonderfull ſecretes cannot knowne vnleſſe god haue inlightened v holy ſpirit heereby wee bee warned take offence wee ſee wyſe men worlde haue taſt goſpell poynt doctrine saluation diſhe whereof euery man may hys owne caruer god muſt bee fayne worke holy ſpirite thing well worthy bee noted wee ſee many wretched weakling day reſt themſelues vpon thys wiſe men world cannot frame themſelues goſpell ſay ſuch man man ſo great reputation ſauoreth goſpell yea needeth alledging ſome one man whole nation men ſay ſuche nation ſo many wyſe head ſee goſpell receyned ſhould ſay receyuing goſpell came owne towardneſſe motherwit able comprehend ſoeuer god ſheweth v holy scripture cleane contrariwiſe ſayd blinded behalfe wiſdome god fooliſhneſſe man reaſon seeing cace ſtandeth ſo let v thinke ſtraunge though ſuche preſume know themſelues blynded ſort god forſaketh reaſon pride hee ſchoolemaiſter humble little one theſe men great one able take profite god ſchoole ſeeing wee perceyue god blyndeth men ſort let v part learne truſt ourſelues deſire guyde v holy ghoſt ſo gouerne v may ſee cleerely middes darkneſſe world yea hys word creſſet muſt ſerue purpoſe peter diſcourſeth although nothyng darkneſſe world yet ſhall well guyded wee followe doctrine holye ſcripture yet aboue thing god muſt bee fayne inlighten v hys holy ſpirite hee muſt take away kerchief satan hath blindfolded v hee muſt open oure eye seeyng lyeth let v craue grace wyth lowlineſſe vtterly diſtruſting ſelues moreouer let v marke ſaying added lorde ſeeyng thou hast couered theyr eye thou wilt exalte iob ſayeth blind folke whome ſpeaketh ſhall exalted hee meeneth haue told ſhall bee confounded god ſhall laugh skorne make ieſtingſtocke therefore let v bee afrayd leaſt wee bee deſtitute god ſpirit lyght wee ſhould receyue thereby confounded end lord cauſe v driuen foorth headlong like wretched beaſtes ſo wee fall intoo ſo manye irkſome thinges euery man bee aſhamed v yet meane whyle ourſelues perceyue owne ſhame behold world goeth thoſe whome god hath giuen vp lewde mynd sainct paule ſayeth firſt chapter romanes god hathe bereft men witte reaſon ſhall diſcerne aught good fayth wee ſee howe wretched idolater caſt themſelues downe pecce wood worſhip beaſtly thyng yes verely howbeeit god hath blinded men ſort muſt need become ſtarke beaſts fall euill euill finally giue themſelues ouer ſo ſhamefull deedes forgo countenance honeſtie fall working againſt nature dooing thing men would abhorre would looke vppon drunkard ſwine wee would looke vppon whorehunters whiche ſo chafed fire owne luſt haue modeſtie honeſtie ought tremble ſight thereof knowtng frutes god vengeance blindeth men ſieleth vp eye ſuche ſorte bee able ſee diſcerne aught yet laſt parte cōfuzion vve muſt come prophet eſay ſayeth vvhen god hath ſpoken puniſhing blynding men vntill ſayeth prophet vntill city beaten downe theyr people deſtroyed nothing left vnconfounded see frute blinding men therfore muſt walke aduiſedly feare pray god wyll neuer ſuffer v haue eye ſo blyndfolded thus much concerning ſentence iob addeth hee telleth freend flattering tale ſhall haue eye child fayle heere iob ſpeaketh according circumſtance place wee haue ſeene heeretofore opinion freendes namely might perceyued iudged worlde whiche god chozen reprobate much ſay laſt iudgement wherevntoo thing ſhould reſerued wee wyll eſteeme men according god preſent handling heere thing ye ſee vntoward doctrine iudge ſo iob vſeth worde flalterie ſet purpoſe ſhould ſay preacheth proſperitie freend ſay ſhall ſay man gotoo thou art happie thou art beloued god thou proſpereſt thou liueſt thine eaſe thou art rich fauour world ſay talketh thys ſort curſed ſo eye child ſhall fall ſay hee ſhall accurſed onely owne perſone alſo ofſpring heereby warned firſt reſt ſelues vpon proſperitie tranſitorie life bring nothing flatterie marke one poynt leſſon greatly auauntage v practyſe throughly ſayd flatterie men reſt wholly vpon proſperitie tranſitorie worldly life beare themſelues hande bee beloued god cauſe ruine deſtruction sodomite liued pleaſure eaſe whyle arreignement making heauen verely ſentence giuen pronounced againſte perſone abraham sixſcore yeeres flud world ſo exceede delight pleaſures ſeemed god ſhoulde haue charge men ſore abaſhed ſuddayne ſurprizing doubted playne falſhood eſteeme god fauour preſent proſperitie therefore let v take occaſion flatter ſelues ſay god loueth fauoreth v proſpereth v ſay let v beware wee beguyle ourſelues ſort bee confuzion thus yee ſee word flatterie importeth therewithall wee haue note wretched dealing ſelues neybours vſe ſayd flattering euery man dazeleth owne eye ſeeketh lift vp himſelfe againſt god proſperitie deceyue freendes alſo wee make eaſe beleeue bee good god lap yet al gulfe hell neere therefore without cauſe iob doth pronounce ſuch greeuous puniſhment againſt thoſe preach proſperitie ſort neighbour vvhat done effect vvhen proſperitie let v cheere vp one another ſerue god buſie ourſelues yeelding thāks goodneſſe ſheweth v aduerſitie let v take promiſes giuē v cōfort v withall make ſerue purpoſe therewithal let v alwayes ready receyue aduerſitie notwithſtanding god ſhew himſelf gētle louing towards v ſay let v ceaſſe prepare ourſelues chaſtizement let v bee willing receyue ſtripes hys hand pleaſe handle v rigorouſly furthermore let mind troubled ſay god doth hādle men heere according deſerts whenſoeuer afflicteth v let v vnderſtand chaſtizeth v ſinnes hee ſpare v let v vnderſtand hys meening draw v gētleneſſe ſo whatſoeuer betide v let nothing hinder v lift vp heds cōtinually ſeke life cōtentatiō heauē happie reſt tarieth v let greeue v aflicted ſeing god calleth v triūph purchaced v death lord ieſus chriſt let v caſt ourſelues flat face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym make v feele wrath ſuche wiſe oure aduerſities wee may ceaſſe taſt alwayes fatherly mercie haue recourſe ſame ſo grounding ſetling ourſelues therevpon wee may neuer ſwarue doubting deliuer v affliction conuenient time eaſe v al miſeries although bee pinched vttermoſt nowe yet wee ſhall bee fully diſpatched hath bereft v fleſh make v parttakers benefites whych hee hathe prepared v aloft hys heauenly glorye wee ſhall triumphe oure lorde ieſus chriſt according hee hath gone afore v glorye reſurrection maye pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation earth c lxvj sermon ſecond vpon xvij chapter 6 hath made common byvvord ſet open gazingſtocke 7 myne eye dimmed vvith ſorovve limbes ſhadovve 8 rightuouſe vvill bee aſtoniſhed innocent ſhall lift vp himſelfe againſt hypocrite 9 rightuouſe vvill hold vvay hath cleane hand ſhall ſtrengthened 10 returne turne ye agayne one vviſe man among 11 dayes glyded avvay mine enterprizes paſt thought hart 12 haue turned day night haue offered mee darkneſſe light approched 13 tarrie graue houſe ſhall make bed dark 14 vvill ſay duſt thou art father corruption thou art mother ſiſter 15 vvhere myne expectation vvhat hope muſt looke 16 ſhall go dovvne bottom graue vvee ſhall bee layed earth bed ſhall duſt iob following matter entered afore intēdeth ſhew briefly reſpect preſent ſtate vtterly forlorne remedie miſeries seing cace ſuch muſt faine conclude talk thoſe ſpake afore true wit mē delt within world according deſerts muſt eſteme god grace loue hatred according ſtate preſent lyfe ſhall boote flee vnto god ye ſee effect haue marke firſt al ſayd god hath made mockingſtocke ſet gazingstock men make tale ſecond woord vſeth haue tranſlated gazingſtocke ſignifieth timbrell marke ſome men haue thought iob ment compare heere proſperitie aduerſitie ſo great extreme time ſayd heretofore haue bene great triumph nowe god hath handled ſuch wiſe ſee ſelf byword gazingſtocke true ſteade gazingstocke ſome trāſlate hel whereas haue tranſlated open ſight ſo opinion iob ment ſay men damned wretched creature tyme well conſidered playne meening haue touched repeting one matter twyce greater confirmation according common cuſtome holie scripture therefore thing intēdeth ſet downe aſmuch god hath made mirrour aduerſitie wee ſhould eſteeme men god fauour diſpleaſure ſtate preſent life wee ſhould hold forlorne perſone yet take himſelfe none ſuch howbeit vtterly without feeling infirmity ſoeuer yet fight agaynſt ſure fully reſolued god would length pitie therefore hild mouth ſhet vntill ſawe ſome end miſeries reſpect addeth rightuouſe ſhall astoniſhed yet neuertheleſſe innocent ſhall lift vp himſelfe againſt hypocrite rightuouſe ſhall hold wayes ſuch haue cleane handes ſhall gather new ſtrength ſtedfaſt ſaying ryghtuouſe ſhall bee astoniſhed iob meeneth wee ſee aduerſities god ſendeth ſuch haue ſerued walked feare pure conſcience thinke ſtraunge abaſhed good ſooth ſee runnes minde god gouerne world good reaſon ſhould ſpare good men ſuch haue indeuered walk purely ſhould handle father doeth child ſee thē afflicted extremely god hand imagin eyther hath turned backe wil think vpō earthly thing elſe paſſeth mē liue behaue thēſelues cauſe oftētymes aſtoniſhed aduerſitie rightuouſe mē god ſeemeth ſhewe himſelf enemie ſee nothing ſignes crueltie cauſe iob ſpeaketh aſtoniſhment howbeit ſayeth yet neuertheleſſe innocentes ſhall auaunce themſelues aboue hypocrite ſay ſhal ſo ſore aſtoniſhed ſhal make good winding vp ſentence ought marke better thā vvhy ſo know experiēce hard men iudge aright god dooings reſpect ſee preſently hath bene declared fully already god executes iudgemēts ſuch ſort world thing ſhould well ruled nothing ſquare contrariwyſe thing confounded ſee wicked man puniſhed rightuouſe man puniſhed much wee ſee good man proſper wicked man ſhall proſper double vvhere ſee ſuch thing vvee aſtoniſhed wee wit end ſay know way turne v wee iudge preſent thing naturall reaſon wee muſt needes rauiſhed holie scripture telleth v wee ſhall ſo although god ſuffer v haue experiēce yet hath alſo voutchſafed warn v woord wit ſhall troubled dazeled looke vpon thing ſeeme go therefore let v marke well ſentence ſayd ryghtuouſe ſhall aſtoniſhed ſee god afflicteth child ſorte verie deede point alſo croſſe miſliketh v according alſo terme ſuch thing aduerſities miſlike v harde comberſome aſmuchas wee ſhunne affliction ſorte needes muſt wee caryed away aſtoniſhment reaſon gaynſtryuing nature ſee god afflicteth child maner layeth vpon thē great ſtrokes whē ſee lord ſpareth thoſe hath chozen himſelf hath giuen grace walke purely feare ſeruice doubt ſelues ſay ſee wee forced aſtoniſhed thing learned leſſon vve might ouertaken ſuch feare wee ſhould neuer returne right way againe vvherfore let v take warning blow come wee ſee good men handled roughly god hand let v therefore offended ſet al randon let v keepe ſelues tarying myre let v vnderſtand behoueth v paſſe come iob ſayeth follow wit ſoeuer come muſt ceaſſe lift vp ſelues againſt deſpizers god hereby ye ſee wherein faythfull differ faithleſſe may ſeeme bee bothe like cace worldwarde vtterly plundged ouer head eares imagination god gouerneth worlde ſheweth himſelf iudge winketh thing ſpecially child oppreſſed without releef wheras meane wicked haue full ſcope bridle layd looce vppon necke without redreſſe thing reſt vpon point cannot rid hand trouble temptation vvhat behoueth v man myre muſte fayne wade force till come firme grounde ſayde fortith pſalme euen ſo wee feele diuell goeth make v ſinke deepeſt bottomleſſe pit meanes would driue v deſpayre let v ſtreyne ſelues ſay let v inforce ſelues till come point wee haue wonne ſo much able ſay yet god neuer forſake ſeruants though ſeeme oppreſſed ſo ſeeme deede ſheweth himſelfe ſtrong ynough ſuſteyne thē continually hand make feele length deliuered woonderfull faſhion marke ſay exercizes marke battels god intendeth imploy v ſay ſee thing confuzed world greued time muſt labour releeue ſelues vntill wee haue gotten victorie ſuch temptation iob expreſſeth full whiche touched breefly ſaying rightuouſe ſhall hold way whiche hath cleane handes ſhall ſtrengthened behold verie profitable leſſon cauſeth many men ſtep ſquare bicauſe would recōpenced firſt day god cōtent thē appetite thinke labour loſt ſerue ought take ſo much peynes ſeing wage good bad impacience cauſeth many men greeued turne backe yea loſe corage though haue begon well folowe god vvherefore let v marke ſayd rightuouſe may take ſome conceyt diſquiet ſelues ſeing good men ceaſſe bee perſecuted ſomuch god ſeemeth either haue forgotten elſe become aduerſarie ſeing perſecuteth ſort although good men feele thēſelues greeued time yet muſt ſtrengthen themſelues vntill haue cōcluded hold way ſay continue throughout although ſee way wherthrough muſt paſſe full thornes bryers ſo muſt fayne leape ouer hedge rock diches yet muſt ceaſſe continue god ſeruice triall examinatiō faith ſhould vvere faire medow might runne along riuers ſide ſhadow might nothing pleaſure ioy whole life could vaunt ſerued god good affection god ſendeth v thing cleane contrarie deſire muſt fayne one enter quamire another marche vppon rugged ſtones anotherwyle bee combered bryers thornes whē muſt fayne meete hedge diches leape ouer ſhall haue traueled greate ſhall ſtill ſeeme haue gone verie little nothing foreward yet ſee ende iourney behold troubleſome tēptation v couet walk according god wil ſo bicauſe haue vtterly
