renounced ſelues hath yet learned tame affectiōs ſubdue ſeruing god notwithſtanding hard doo knoweth yet good earneſt liue well faithfully thē let v practize ſpoken holding wayes ſay knowing wee deſirouſe rule life according god lawe way verie difficult done without many let hinderance yet muſt firme conſtant hold way ſtill ſith god ſendeth child ſuch triall wit hee ſuffereth much vexation yet neuertheleſſe muſt hold ſtill tackling ſhall become ſuch forſake right way without vexing troubling ſee many men behold lord ſo graciouſe vnto ſome beare thē reſpect weakneſſe well handleth owne nature ſo ſendeth ouerſtrong temptation yet fayle go awrie though tooke pleaſure forſaking god wilfully pray would doo aſſayled like temptation iob ſpeaketh would vnthankfulneſſe moſte men appeere howe many repine god without maner diſtreſſe man aske doo temptation hath moued none matter bycauſe bee ſo maliciouſe froward nature wil needes vtterly accurſed let v part well aduized although way wherby god haue v paſſe full greate hardneſſe ſhall haue much doo ſteppe foorthe one pace wee ſhall meete ſome hard incounter yet notwithſtanding wee muſt keepe way ſtill according ſhewed howbeit foraſmuch cānot done without gathering new ſtrength therfore iob addeth hath cleane hand ſhall gather new ſtrength hereby let v note firſt v ſuch feebleneſſe wee flatter ſelues become werie ſo ſoone know ſelues weake would ſerue god quite vndone ſhould conſtancie ſtedfaſtnes v let v conſider little frayle wee meene euen thoſe god hath giuen ſome good zele iob ſpeaketh ſuch ſticke naturall reaſon treateth ſuch haue ſpirite god dwelling thē haue already receyued ſuche vertue aboue diſpozed weldoing yet neuertheleſſe euen ſuch maner men frayle ſtill find themſelues ſo voyd ſtrength god preſſe knowe ſhoulde withſtand temptation therefore haue neede gather new ſtrength wee muſt ſhrink though wee feele ſuch weakeneſſe ſelues ſayde god child ſhall ſtrengthened therby ſee although weake god beareth v ſhakes v verely ſo wee flatter ſelues hypocriſie number fode themſelues owne vice ſaying ô man able notwithſtāding know haue ſo many fleſhly infirmity beare themſelues hande well diſcharged alledging commō ordinarie vice men cōtrarywiſe ſayd oft god maketh v feele owne weakneſſe warning make v learne ſeeke remedie vvherefore let v beware nurriſhing owne vice ſelfflatterie let v beware ſeeke fond excuſes many folke beguile themſelues weening god forgiue fault though labour amend cōtrarywiſe let v looke gather ſtrength wher ſhall get certainly found elſwhere god men find themſelues weake let go ſeeke ſtrength holie scripture telleth ſayd god hath ſpirite ſtrength ſtedfaſtneſſe wee feare borne downe temptation afrayd ſwaruing let v deſire god ſtrengthen v lo faythfull ſtrengthen themſelues vayne ouerweening doo truſt owne free chalendging woonderfull thing themſelues bearing themſelues hand come compaſsing intent whereas ende ſtep aſide well ſeene nothing vanitie vvill well ſtrengthened let v preſume vpon owne ryghtuouſneſſe let v returne vnto god beſeeching ſtrengthen v ſuch wiſe holie ghoſte diuell may able fell v downe though aſſayle v neuer ſo many battells lo lyfe faythfull effect wit ſhall neuer bee without many temptation ſpecially wee bee ſubiect ſo many miſeries tyme earthly wayfaring ſuch indeuer ſerue god beſt ceaſſe often ouerpreſſed many inconueniences many affliction vvhen aſtoniſhed cannot muſt thinke ſtrange firſte brunt let v fight againſt ſuche temptation let v holde right way without ſtarting although find much hardneſſe ourſelues let v pray god giue v ſuch inuincible ſtrength may continue ſeruice euen end notwithſtanding satan labour thruſt v iob ſpeaketh purpoſely heere ſuch haue cleane handes surely true pureneſſe conſiſteth hart leaſt wiſe harte place taketh roote nothing woorth though life perfect angellike man could wiſhe except pure rightmeening minde ſerue god man may well withhold himſelf working euil may forbeare bodie wrong harme may refreyne giuing folke cauſe complayne caſt thing teeth hart bee inflamed vaynglorie atteynted hypocriſie ſelfwilled bee infected vice ſecretly whole ſtate filthineſſe yea though neuer ſo highly commended men thus ye ſee ſayd wee muſte begin minde hath bene ſhewed heretofore chapter alſo diuers place nowe iob hauing ſpoken rightuouſe innocent ſoundmeening man matched againſt hypocrite addeth partie hath cleane handes ſtandeth v hande haue inward ſoundneſſe god yet moreouer muſt alſo ſhewe deedes bee ſuch ſeeme wee ſee ſuch full naughtineſſe vtter deſpyzers god bold brag themſelues thoſe beſt chriſtians man finde fault bee ſhort adayes man haue faire proteſtations muſt ſeeke wickeddeſt ſort thoſe puffed vp ſelfe eſtimacion inſomuch come foorth like ſhameleſſe harlotts stewes cā find fault yet verie babe deſcerne life ſo abhominable verie ayre ſtinks reaſon hereof purpoſely ſayd intend ſhewe ſound afore god hand muſt alſo pure cleane ſay wee muſte liue ſuch ſort among men doings may ſhewe feare god within v ſhort yee ſee wiſe behoueth v yeeld record goodneſſe roote man ſhould ſay vnto v good tree yet appered frute beareth good goodneſſe verely frute cō me ſhall neuer good except roote nature tree good yet muſt yeeld frute ſayd wee intend ſhewe truly haue ſayd right ſound meening hart ſtudie ſerue god thus ye ſee effect haue remē ber ſentence iob addeth turne ye turne ye ſayeth wiſe man among ſpeaking ſo diſproue talke bene miniſtred thoſe three diſcourſed haue herd heretofore ſhewe man forſaken god nothing curſedneſſe bicauſe ſawe ſo perſecuted iob hath ſhewed iudgement muſt giuen aduerſities ſeene preſent life ſay man forſaken god marke well point afterward ſayth againe god doeth alwaies puniſh men ſinnes good men ſometimes afflicted noman knowes reaſon therof appereth inquire man neuer ſo much trauel neuer ſo much yet ſhal neuer neerer bicauſe god iudgments ſecret incomprehenſible foraſmuch iobs freends conceiued ſuch thing ſayth wiſedome certeſſe haue ſayde afore ſmall point wiſdome diſcerne aright affliction god ſendeth vpon men ſay man owne cace viſited hand god great wiſedome haue skil know ſinnes enter himſelfe humble himſelfe acknowledge behold right profitable medicine mee god knew ſuche vice hath done grace knowe therefore muſt apply wholly mine owne vſe meanes ſhal know profit himſelf greatly god correction beſides although know preciſely afflicted able lay finger vpon yet ſhal wiſdome conclude vvell lord thou knoweſt priuie diſeaſes though haue done amiſſe perceiue ſelf thou lord knoweſt thou art true phiſicion giue grace ſmitten thy hand may alwayes take good thy correction diſcipline yea albeit mā perceiue god doeth wiſe puniſh ſinnes yet muſt neuertheleſſe humble himſelf ſo farre ſay ala lord knowe wherefore thou doeſt ſure thou art rightuouſe ynough though thou doo make mee forget world draw thy ſelf make mee taſte heauenly life reſtreyne giuen worldly delight man ſo skilfull know apply god chaſtizings inſtruction ſurely point great wiſdome wee ſhall haue profited greatly time life come point much ſayd correction god ſendeth neighbour vvhen ſee man ſo ſmittē may ſuppoſe chaſtized ſinnes yea truly haue knowne deſpyzer god diſordered perſone good thinke god puniſheth ſame cauſe wee muſt iudge neighbour leaſt ſame come home v againe immediatly ſorte god thou puniſh ſuch one ſhalt thou much puniſh wheras thou haſt giuen grace haue ſome deſire ſerue thee lorde ſo much bound vnto thee thou liſt chaſtize muſte indure yet woorſe geere muſt come remembrance againe ſee puniſh one man whoredome another mannes drunkenneſſe third man blaſphemie ſome men robbery guilefulnes periurie well muſt alwayes profit ſelues ſuch thing according alſo paule ſayeth peynted table wherein god ſheweth v howe ſore hateth abhorreth vnrightuouſneſſe behoueth v make owne gayne mennes loſſes ſayd prouerbe furthermore let v ouer rigorous ſee god ſmite ſuch folke haue bene detected ſuche great vnmeaſurable miſdoing might ſay behold yonder naughtipacks behold yonder deſpyzers god man hath ſome infirmity yet ſhall haue ſhewed ſome ſignes vprightneſſe wee ſee great aduerſitie wee muſte ſay well god knoweth afflicteth poore creature yet muſt haue pitie cōpaſsion ye ſee dauid ſayeth bliſſed man iudge aright aduerſitie wit cā beare god ſeruants child ſee oppreſſed aduerſitie pitie gende condemne thē hooke crooke aſſuring ſelues men may condemne v double like rigour ſhould vſed againſt v without cauſe iob doth reproue freends finding wiſdome bicauſe iudged randon aduerſities hereby warned well taught god ſchoole get true wiſdome may welfare behoueth v apply mindes conſidering god iudgements world well vpon ourſelues vpon neighbour beate vpon point earely late man indeuereth himſelfe put vre ſurely time well imployed cheef point doctrine god bringeth v ſhould apply iudgements owne vſe edified feare therfore proceede maner ſurely perfect wiſedome v without may haue ſhewe wiſdome deuiſed may diſcourſe curiouſly vpon holy ſcripture may bring many faire allegacions yet ſhal vanitie till come point iudge aright lord requireth v ſendeth v chaſtizements afflictiōs herevpon conclude matter iob ſayeth dayes paſſed thought vaniſhed enterprizes broken diſappointed bad darkneſſe ſtead light thought day ſprang night ſhort ſheweth v end miſeries hope euer ſhould continue touching preſent life cauſe addeth ſayd rottenneſſe thou art father vnto duſt thou art moother ſister ſhould ſay regard eyther kinſfolk freendes bylowe god hath hidden cut rank companie liuing like wretched carion muſt looke returne ſay creature eaſe matter queſtion ſo vtterly diſpatched remedie cace vvhat mine expectation haue ſayeth haue looked vp downe must go downe pit bedde muſt bylowe ſay death whatſoeuer hope ſoeuer build hebrew woord iob vſeth may come building verie fit ſimilitude ſpeaketh hope expectation yet neuertheleſſe hath eye building doubtfulneſſe woord reſpect ſignification therefore one ſayd although bee patient prolong miſerie continually yet remayneth nothing mee graue likeneth expectation building may well builde ſayeth hee thinking ſtill ſome hope left ſhal ſpeede euer better ſayes vvhen haue builded beſt ſhall haue none houſe graue ſeemeth iob ſpeaks man taſte heauenly life wiſt god mercie ment behoueth v conſider telleth tale true heretofore fittes diſputed againſt god ſhewed wel terrible conceit notwithſtanding reſiſted hath treated fitts felt ſheweth follie would haue god fauor vtter ſelf vnchaungeably preſent life vpō good faithful god ſhewe himſelf merciful open face world towards thoſe ought concluded hath forſaken vtterly paſt hope recouerie iob mocketh geere telleth tale ſuch would ſee mennes full payment tranſitorie decaying life ouerfroward doctrine iudge ſo haue declared alredy vvherfore let v mark iob mā deſpayre reproueth follie ſuch ſayd freendes yet would make beleue euen worlde wee ſhall ſurely perceiue whither wee god fauour grace whither forſaken better cōprehending hereof let v looke vpon argument paule maketh intendeth aſſure v laſt reſurrection vve ſayeth wretcheddeſt men earth let man compare chriſtiās deſpyzers god heathen folke hypocrits tha ſpyte god ful ſee thē beſt intreated certaine take one another man ſhall ſee proſperitie thē giuen euill ſhall doo walke feare god lord neere vnto v watcheth ouer v ſo amiſſe amendeth man haue care correct child thā neyghbours god therefore ſhew loue beareth v chaſtizeth v whē ſeeth v amiſſe againe intendeth proue obedience good reaſon ſhould intendeth ratifie faith faith ſo preciouſe thing deſerueth tried gold ſiluer rather peter telleth v moreouer know diuell ceaſſeth practize poſsible againſt v ſeeth v heedfull ſeruice god ſo much rage ſet fire alſo looke many wicked folk ſo manie enimies haue satan ſerueth turne trouble v therfore muſt maruell though god child bee moſt miſerable world paule vſeth ſelfſame argument ſhewe looke better ſtate sith mē ſhake v ſayeth ſith treade v vnder feete ſith reproch laughingſtocke whole world cace hoped reſurrectiō promiſed v lord ieſus chriſt muſt come ſhall perceiue haue ſerued god vayne god heauen iuſtice prouidence ye ſee paules argument muſte ſerue v key open text yee ſee mee ſayth iob man paſt hope vvhen haue made windlaſſes muſt fayne come graue lodging ſee nothing rottenneſſe round aboute mee sith ſo yee make mee beleeue god doeth handle men beneathe thereafter doeth loue hate mee knowe haue indeuered ſerue god diſappointed myne expectation yet ſee ſelfhandled roughly may euery man lookes skew mee gazingſtocke cōmon word vvhat remaineth thē eyther muſte burie benefit priuiledge god hath giuen mee caſt quite away elſe muſt conclude god mocketh abuſeth ſeruants vaine thē truſt vnto promiſes would ye haue fall ſuch wickedneſſe ſith cace ſtandeth ſo let v vnderſtād muſt iudge god loue hatred thing ſee let v procede conſider god loueth thoſe ſcourgeth keepeth taſte goodneſſe ſtore though bee hidden thē time whē ſheweth nothing vtter rigour againſt therfore let v cōfort ourſelues ſay yet hold ſtill hope continually god length pitie mee ſhall perceyue father although haue happened lift vp ſelf againſt time yet wil ſtill returne ſayd concluſion vve ſee maner doctrine haue gather ſentēce better edifying wit muſt take al miſeries preſent life ſpecially thoſe wee ourſelues feele ſee al god child opē declaratiō god reſerueth much better thing v ſame muſt cauſe confirme v hope heauenly life ſee paule ſpeaketh ſecond theſſalonians reherſing one ſuffered many thing bene vexed wicked ſayeth euident token god iuſt iudgement reaſonable thing agreeable nature giue releef ye haue ben ſo oppreſſed therfore aſſure yourſelues ſeing haue reſt vpon earthe god prepareth heauē otherſide thing ſtandeth vpō god iuſtice wicked ſhuld puniſhed according deſerts yet notwithſtāding ſee done worlde aſſure yourſelues aduerſities trouble miſeries god doth glaſſe ſhewe ſhall oneday come vnto alſo verie thing wherevnto hope muſt bee referred long wee world god ſend v neuer ſo much pouertie tribulation let v learne drawen hope heauenly life vvhen ſee good folk god ſillie child roughly handled laughed ſcorne pacience abuſed themſelues left ſuccorleſſe ſay whē ſee al let v vnderſtād god declareth although thing confuzed earthly life yet muſt wee therfore runne ſquare looke afore v wee muſte neſtle ourſelues world theſe corruptible thing onely paſſe thē right ſwiftly full gallop furthermore god ſpare v let v acknowledge pitieth v interteyning v reſt giue v ſome taſt goodneſſe ſpecially haue ſame ſerue time come intent ſhould lerne bolder truſt doubting deliuer v battels aſſaults world make v partaker benefit whiche hath prepared ſuch come willingly ſhroude themſelues vnder ſhadow lord ieſu chriſt let v caſt ourſelues downe face good god acknowledgmēt ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may returne vnfeinedly returning come true fayth repentance deſirouſe rid vice corruption fleſh douting lord alwayes behold v pitie receiue v mercie ſake hath giuen v mediator ſo let v ſay almightie god c lxvij sermon firſt vpon xviij chapter bildad suite anſvvered ſaying 2 vvhen vvill yee make ende vvoordes herken let v ſpeake 3 vvherefore vvee counted beaſts opinion dullardes value 4 man teareth ovvne ſoule rage ſhall earth forſaken thy ſake shall rockes bee remoued place 5 verely light vvicked ſhall bee quenched ſparke fire ſhall ſhine 6 light ſhall bee dimmed tent lampe ſhyneth vpon ſhall put 7 ſteppes ſhall reſtreyned ovvne deuice ſhall caſt dovvne 8 net ſpred vnder feete ſhall vvalke vpon snare 9 grinnes ſhall catch heele theeues ſhall come vpon 10 pitfall hidden earth trappe vvay 11 fearfulneſſe ſhall make afrayd euery ſide driue feete vvhich vvay ſoeuer go ſhall make fall haue tolde heretofore true profitable doctrine god puniſheth men fault ſhewe himſelf iudge ſo ſame vnderſtood handled skilfully ſee 〈…〉 ugh take ſome point holy scripture generall muſt ſo apply vſe may fare better alſo experience ſheweth number abuſe holy scripture toſsing thing fro taking aduenture whiche ſpeake true ſo well applied turne cleane cōtrarie meening holy ghoſt ſo truth vtterly corrupted ſelf ſame thing doth bildad newe vndertaketh ſpoken afore namely although wicked proſper time yet ſhal cōfounded end god ſuffer proſperitie laſt euer true therewithall paſſeth meaſure vpholding puniſhments god ſendeth vpō wicked alwayes ſo full apparant men may finally diſcerne eyeſight god iudgeth preſent life whereas contrarywiſe alwayes ſeene nother muſt make general rule lo wherin bildad ouerſeene yea notwithſtanding doctrine ſelf good holie ſo although firſt bluſh ſeeme harme yet throughly perſwaded wit god puniſheth wicked mē ſo ſeene eye great daunger inſue proofe therof thing fall contrarie expectation ſeeme vntoo v god iudge worlde hath giuen vp office thing ruled fortune curſed blaſphemie herevpon ſhall tempted ſuch impatiencie ſhall ſtomacke wee ſee god ſetteth ſtay thing diſordered finally wee ſhall prouoked giue ſelues naughtineſſe ſhall thinke loſt time ſpent doyng good ſeing god hath regard mē guide leaueth randon ſhort ſo little ſhall able call vpon ſhal vtterly eſtraunged frō ſo vnder ſhadow good doctrine bildad turneth religion feare god vpſide downe ſetteth men ſtate deſpayre thus ye ſee ſayde ſtandeth v greatly hand deſire god giue v skill apply owne profite edifying thing reade holie scripture ſoeuer el ſhewed v al time concerning iugemēts firſt al bildad greeued herkened ſayings receyued verely taught faithfully purpoſe iuſt cauſe diſpleaſed wee appointed beare abrode god woorde doctrine ſaluation ſee men heare v hardned elſe hold ſcorne thing tell ſurely wee haue zele godward reuerence woorde muſt needes grieued ſorie hart deſpite toucheth v liuing god whoſe meſſengers therefore ſerueth god faithfully carying abrode woorde muſt ſorie labour profite ſith men doo wrong vnto god receyuing woord ſide muſt much v lieth procure health mennes ſoules ſee men go deſtructiō bicauſe giue eare vnto god ſo headſtrōg agaynſt good counſell beholde vtterly vndone ought ſay vexe v hart bildad taught ought haue done iuſt cauſe complayne men hearing histale aſmuch corrupted truthe turned lie reaſon ſhould grieued notwithſtanding whenſoeuer man offereth v doctrine bee warned hereby diſcerne reiect thing wee knowe wee ſee ſome make great matter reiect man go ſhewe health ſoule therefore lette v haue ſuch pryde v wee ſhall onely greeue men ſeeke welfare willing v ſeruice ſhal alſo grieue ſpirite god dwelleth giueth loue edifie v offer v good conuenient v ye ſee haue neede beware deſpiſing offered v till wee know furthermore bildad doth vpbrayde iob teareth ſoule rage thereby warned haue touched afore whē men martyr themſelues paſsions gayne nothing plundge themſelues ſtill miſerie ſhall alſo returne vpon owne head true man aduerſitie thinkes himſelfe well eaſed murmuring ſtorming ſtomacking ſpecially belke ſome blaſphemie againſt god lo ſay men woulde fayne wreake themſelues god holdeth aduerſitie cace ende cleane contrariwize nothing elſe rende owne ſoules yea euen furiouſly ſayd ſtreyne heathen mē skill ynough ſay man choler burning headie furiouſneſſe man cannot ſubmit himſelfe god aduerſitie ſharpeneth himſelfe ſtill pray one ſtarke madde al one would ſtande againſt god ſay wee ſhould vtterly without paſsions god ſendeth v aduerſities affection vnbrydled vnruly ſerue kindle v ſpurre v foreward againſt god ſo wee bee full bitterneſſe muſte needes followe poſſeſſed furie haue ſayde alreadie ſeing wee come iuſtle ſort againſt god durſt creature ſo bereft right wittes reaſon ſurely durſt ſee ye text ought marke well although bildad miſapply perſone iob yet ſentence true ſelfe ought ſerue turne aſmuch ſee impaciencie kinde madneſſe man ment impaciencie ſimply greef conceyued miſlyking aduerſities wee werie exceſsiue hartburning ſtomaking againſt wee cannot ſubmit ſelues ſimply vnto god diſpoſe v pleaſure therfore paſsiōs ſo vnruly keepe meaſure aduerſities dothe impaciencie ouermaſter v wee haue hold ſtay ſelues wee muſt needes conclude wee better frentike folke againſt god yea vtterly wittes true confeſſe ſo ſo much holie ghoſt hath auouched would haue competent iudge looke well ſelues nothing texte experience ſheweth true let v aſſure ſelues hath power bridle affection hold ſhort hath gotten great wiſedome vndoubtedly ſelf ſame purpoſe alſo iames ſayeth man want wiſdome let aske god ſpoken afore patience friend ſayeth whenſoeuer god afflicteth light tēptations aſſure ſelues profit welfare yet foloweth ſame may ſeeme ſtraunge fewe men ſhall agree therevnto man haue neede wiſdome let reſort vnto god ſhould ſay true man minde neuer thinke al tēptations aduerſities benefit god procuremēt towards v fault bicauſe miſaduiſed knowe expedient v vvhat done aſmuch want wiſdome ſpecially paſsions ouermaiſter v trouble mindes let v repayre vnto god well skill ſupplie want thus ye ſee haue gather vpō ſentēce namely muſt applie indeuer bridle affectiōs great choler god afflicteth v aſſuring ſelues take paciently god wil turne al profit welfare contrary wiſe ſtomacke matter aſſwage miſeries cōfort god giueth v end euen ſuch bildad ſheweth wit wee ſhall teare owne ſoules ſee wretched madman fling himſelfe fire leapes windowes hurteth one whyle himſelf whyle othermē fit frenzie taketh euen ſo ſhal caried away choler wil make bone ruſh ſquare againſt god remembring whit ſhall turne owne confuſion therfore haue neede wey wel doctrine wit teare owne ſoules learne referre ourſelues wholly god good may v pleaſeth thus ye ſee effect wee haue beare minde ſayde shall world chaunged thy ſake shall rockes remoued place expound ſentence curiouſly thus shall world ſay ſhall order god hath ſet ſtabliſhed chaunged ſhall rocke ſay ſhall god whiche ſtrength worlde hee remoued place theſe thing much racked bildad ment ſpeake ſimplie namely iob talke peruerted order nature effect thing hee ment bildad ſet downe aſſoone god made heauen earth ſettled naturall order wee ſee behoued alſo iuſtice ſhould haue courſe true howbeit miſtaketh would haue god iuſtice altogither apparant ſo men might know behold eye touche finger wherein beguyleth himſelfe neuertheleſſe good vnderſtand meening wee may gather inſtruction conteyned ſaying ſhall worlde bee chaunged thy ſake ſay vnderſtādeſt thou thou reaſoneſt god doth ſo execute iuſtice bylow may knowne would god haue iudgemēts knowne forthwith frōthe time ſtabliſhed order heauen ayre earth wee behold god workes aboue beneath end goodneſſe wiſedome rightfulneſſe vertues ſhould knowne yes queſtion end hath god ſet ſo fayre lookingglaſſe creature ende glorified hand ſith ſo like god vttereth vertues reſt ſo alſo wil haue v priuie iudgemēts true ſome reſpect wit ſo vnderſtood ought bildad ſtretcheth generally vvhat done oft man ſpeaketh v god let workes ſheweth v neereſt vnto v leade v cōtinually higher vnto example scripture ſpeakes oftentimes v ſee dayly wit god ſendeth rayne fayre wether maketh earth yeeld fruite cauſeth nurriſh v ynough v know rayne fayre wether come god earth yeeldeth v foode grace true thoſe fundacions yet muſt go mount vp higher wit god giue ſuch power earth muſte much rather needes follow receyue ſtrēgth much nobler creature life v far greater excellenter thing power earth hath yeeld fruite▪ yes certenly behoueth v acknowledge ſame one god workes proceedeth againe yf god haue care feede men world thinke father behalf vouchſaueth haue regarde body wretched carkaſes doth make much account ſoules alſo caſting ſeede earth rotting cauſe ſpyre againe beare fruyte anew reſtore v better lyfe though wee go corruption ſeing ſheweth ſuch power order nature beſides god keepeth ſtedie hand making sunne ryze go downe euery day moreouer moone finiſheth hir circuite euery moneth ſunne euery yeere ſee orderlineſſe ſtarres planet oft wee beholde theſe thing muſt cōclude god ſtedfaſt truth giueth v ſome inſtructions ſignes thereof vvhen ſee ſuch conſtancie ſettled order nature ſhal thinke promiſes belong ſaluatiō corruptible thing ſubiect alteracions chaunges world lo holy scripture trayneth v higher higher thoſe workes god neereſt moſt familiar v neuertheleſſe behoueth v alſo haue skill diſcerne betwene god workes neede requireth yee ſee bildad vtterly cōfounded owne matter ſayeth bicauſe god hath created world ſettled order maynteyneth ſame therfore foloweth iudgements al certeyne men may ſee know ill cōſequēce vvhy god wil ſunne ſhould rize go downe thereby aſſertayned wil giue v al thing neceſſary preſeruatiō life euen worldes ende vvhen ſee vine tree earth yeeld fruite well▪ god ſheweth v hath care preſent life notwithſtanding flightful drooping ſo take v hand lift v vp heauē vnto himſelf god thē wil haue v know moſt certenly ſo cōmaundeth v touching iudgemēts cace minde wee ſhould haue taſt thē life ſhould wayte pacience till ſhew thē full latter day ſhall thing ſet order nowe order vntil thē god wil execute iudgements part ſo cōcluſiō bildad maketh good conuenient mingleth twoo thing togither betweene great diuerſitie vvherfore behoueth v vſe diſcretiō behalfe vnderſtand ſentēce true yet miſapplied ſentēce true inaſmuch order nature teacheth coūſeleth v ſeeke thing higher wit knowe wiſedome rightuouſneſſe goodneſſe trueneſſe god thing cōcerne tranſitorie life alſo thing pertayne euerlaſting kingdome heauē vnthankfulneſſe heynous ſhall excuſed ought vynes put eies ought riuers field al like thing ſame wherin god ſheweth repreſenteth ſelf vnto v cōceyue muſt blindneſſe ſay periſhing owne ignorāce needes wilfull let v come ſpoken verely light wicked ſhall quenched lampe ſhyneth vpon head ſhalbe dimmed ſhall remayne one ſparke fire ſuch ſimilitudes bildad ment ſignifie effect god ſuffer wicked proſper euer howbeit muſt marke well true god giue wicked leaue liue eaſe time triūph ruffle though fortune hande bildad bene ware poynt would haue locked vp himſelf ſo ſtreytly doth afterward graunteth wicked may ſometimes proſper vvherein ouerſhooteth himſelfe foreſetteth time maner day proſperitie ſhould take end god ſhould turne laughter weeping v appoynt god may ſometimes leade forth wicked proſperitie euē graue ſo world ſhall ſee haue partly touched wit ſhall go downe graue without trouble turning hand according alſo ſayd pſalme beholde ſayeth dauld god child drag lynes cordes doo put pyne away bylowe ſeemeth death purſueth yet notwithſtanding take away fare wicked luſtie ſtrong die ere aware sith ſo let v marke well▪ v ſet god terme ſay ſhould quenche light wicked world thruſt darkneſſe ſay confuſion vve cannot ſo without controlling god beſides aduertized pleaſure ſhould ſo intendeth reſerue ſome iudgement latter day vvhat done firſt let v marke ſayde deſpiſers god hypocrite ſhall haue lampe burning houſe surely hee expreſſeth matter diuers termes libg • lampe ſhining bildads ſpeaking ordinarie maner holy scripture neuertheleſſe light betokeneth nothing elſe wicked liue eaſe pleaſure god ſeemeth ſauuor like contrarie parte common thing haue tribulation anguiſh likened night darkeneſſe nowe let v come backe agayne matter deſpyſers god folke looce life el ſuch haue nothing hypocriſie may wel proſper time ſee yea ſtandeth v hand well acquaynted inured find noueltie v ſhalbe troubled vexed ſhalbe forced giue ouer god ſeruice therfore behoueth v bee poynt god ſuffer wicked liue merily reioyce take pleaſure bylow muſt aſtonied marke one poynt exerciſe needefull v doubt wilt ſeeme harde v howbeit behoueth v accuſtome ſelues ſayd afore moreouer lette v marke ſecondly lorde quench ſayd light wicked haue ſported themſelues whyle pleaſures paſtymes haue taken vp muſt deerely payd cannot miſſe light ſhalbe quēched alſo dauid ſtandeth vpon 37 pſalme exhorteth hee v repine vngodly wee ſee triumph maner ſeemeth world life may bee eſteemed happie themſelues alſo glory though mē beloued god vvhat reaſon doth dauid alledge aſſure v ſayeth al ſhal paſſe away let v tarie ſayeth ſhal ſee happineſſe wicked ſurmiſe thē ſelues haue curſedneſſe true ſhal ſure ynough good fortune terme ſhall like tootoo well end god throw downe wil miſprouoked companie wicked muſt learn paſſe beyōd world vnderſtād god wil ſhew howe nothing worthe haue eaſe world ioy continuance true god doth ſometimes beare vp ſeruants infirmitie ſo▪ long till cut edge wicked men proſperitie according alſo ſayd pſalme ſhould alwaies aduerſitie without releaſe wee might reache hande euill ſay wee bee ſo frayle although wee called vpon god deſirous ſerue yet might bee tempted breake ſquare god moderate affliction alſo repreſſe wicked giuing thē ſuch blowes ſhould beate downe grounde god may well execute ſome iudgements euen tranſitorie life intent ſupport v ſort alwayes nother muſt wee make general rule baldad ſay god wil quenche light wicked demaunded anſwere day morrowe ſay ſet god terme ſorte giue v leaue bee diſapoynted hope therefore lette v put hande hee knowes tyme ſeaſon wherein wicked ſhould bee rooted sometimes ſatteth men ox ſwyne according ſayd prophet nowif mā f •• oxe ſwine trauell full fedde put colde heate ſet labour beaſts ſnetch oxe cut swynes throte euen ſo doth god fat wicked till come brimme graue therefore let v marke well haue ſayd afore namely reſt ſelues vpon god iudgements wee muſt mount aboue worlde wee muſte looke vnto thing yet hidden eye thus yee ſee haue marke ſo wee ſee wicked aduaunced thing fall would wiſh well muſt thinke ſtraunge hath bene ſo beginning world haue father old time bene aſſaulted ſame temptation reſiſted let v leaue god onely let v know al pleaſures wicked doo take worlde ſhal turne confuzion much better god dealt niggardly haue giuen ſo liberally benefites according haue abuſed goodneſſe ſo muſt alſo fayne puniſhed ſo much grieuouſly vnthankefulneſſe alſo lette v tarie till god worke office ſay til quench light wicked herewithal haue mark well maner ſpeeches ſet downe heere bildad ſayeth nettes layde vnder feete wicked cannot paſse ſtraits riſe vp ſhall caught pitfall ſnares pitched vnder feete howbeit thoſe ſnares bee couered ar perceyued according herevnto dauid alſo ſayeth wicked ſhall walke alwayes vpon yee true way gliſtereth fayre eye ſure footing god make treade ſtep awrie breake necke thought theſe ſimilitudes agree one wit ſhewe although wicked proſper happineſſe wondered •• eſtimation yea coueted whole worlde yet notwithſtanding go deſtruction euery man ſay would ſuch man cace wee ſee ſnares couered earth ſeeme god beareth vp wicked haue wing flie ſtie high tumble downe vnhandſomely feete bee vpon earth ſnares vnder true ſee wee bee warned god woorde muſte looke vpon fayth notwithſtanding bildad vnderſtood well ſayd bene ſo hampered ſnares contrarietie vvhy ſo ſaying ſnares couered vnder wicked men feete hee ſhould haue remembred v eſpie vntill god ſhewe ſhall surely v appoynt time muſt men ſubmit themſelues god prouidence ſette downe generall rule lawe ſay god ſo ſo let v ſide looke applie ſayde doctrine right vſe seing ſayd ſnares vnder wicked men feete well let v pray god leade v hand aſſuring ſelues ſnares layde world men satā onely aſſayleth v open warre alſo layeth ambuſhes v practizeth deſtruction priuily muche poſsible vvee therefore ſhould know howe ſtep one pace preſent life wee ſhould daunger caught ſnares vvhen satan hath layde ſnares grinnes v euen ready catch v lorde preſerueth v way made afore v yea wee hilde vp guyded angel ſayde 91 pſalme wicked haue ſnares alwaies pitched true ſooth themſelues men alſo doo thinke bee exceeding happie bycauſe know prepared thē ynough knowe ſnares layde catch wicked wee muſt note alſo couered therfore ſee fayre pleaſant way wicked frisking ſcoterloping ſeemeth god hold thē backe yet let v ceaſſe therfore cōclude horrible deſtructiō prepared wee muſt iudge owne conceyt ſeeming ſuch ſo falſifie holy scripture wee deſirous ſee ſnares ſayd hiddē earth therefore let v contented bee ignorāt till god diſcouer iudgements vnto v meane ſecrete iudgements cannot cōceyued fayth wee would haue experience owne fancie naught ye ſee faythfull ought brydle themſelues oft god ſhall ſeeme fauour wicked minded puniſh bring account vvherefore let good men ſtand alwayes vpon concluſion vvell know theſe men ende yet god iudge worlde wayt paciently till ſee falling matter ſhall haue perceyued wicked caught doubt god accompliſheth ſayeth though meane doth knowne therfore mount aboue boundes ſuffiſeth mee giue glorie vnto god thing doth therewithall pray may profite ſelfe thereby put ſtint mention made heele▪ purpoſely although bildad eye ſpoken ſnares vnder grounde ſo wicked caught yet notwithſtanding vnder woorde heele hee ſheweth muſt maruel though god make wicked ſtumble firſt blowe ſuffer runne long race ſeemeth bee come vttermoſt triumph euer beareth downe giueth ſuch counterbuffe maketh breake necke therefore wee muſt wonder let v ſuffer god wayte vpon wicked ende take heele throw downe hadlong thus yee ſee purpoſe woorde heele ought ſerue v nowe bildad addeth immediatly fearefulneſſe ſhal diſmay ſides make fall euery ſayd ſhould marche narrowe place whither ſocuer went ſhould eſcape ambuſhes true wicked ſhall haue roume long large ynough ſporte according ſee leape fro therefore ſeemeth walke alwayes ſtreyts indeede wee ſee themſelues feele much better wee imagine againe albeit ſee continually yet doth god length performe ſayd euen according bildad vttereth namely feare ſhall diſmay hee miſtaketh woorde feare though god enemy ſhoulde needes knowe conceyue ſinnes bee afrayde repent ſo theſe twoo thing namely wicked ſhould amazed feare yet merry triumphe cannot ſtande togither deſpyzers god would merrie ouerſhoote themſelues forget themſelues become beaſts beleeue able worke wonder think themſelues happieſt men worlde anger god lo ioy wicked ſorte witte furious ioy ioy ſo bereeues wittes reaſon leaues modeſtie yet meane whyle god doth call account ſummoneth within ſo conſtreyned perceyue muſt bee fayne come yet burie knowledge muche contented abyde deafe blind nother ſee • yet heare god ſheweth telleth wee ſee wee ought ſet foorth leſſon wee may practiſe profite effect although wicked haue worlde much ſay lyfe therefore happy vvhat cheife welfare man bee ſure conſcience quiet reſte ſo hee may goe true conſtancie life death yea euen merrie doth befall wicked although ſtreyne themſelues ſet light god bee voyde ſadneſſe yet faine ſorie quiet ſpite teeth hereby wee ſee life vnhappie good haue ſo vnderſtād god mercifull v although vexed ſides yet comfort v middes al ſorrowes ſure god wil end profit welfare confuſion enimies thus ye ſee wee muſt practyze leſſon verely deſerueth bee diſcourſed length ſo ſhall bee god leaue next lecture nowe preſent time ſuffer v goe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hath made v perceyue ſelues well worthie bereft light caſt horrible darkneſſe reiecting grace holy ſpirite offered v may neuertheleſſe pleaſe pity v like hee hath inlightened v woorde holie ghoſte ſo increase ſame light v ſpecially make v proſper knoweth fit v yet meane ſuffer v tied corruptible goodes world reſt ſelues much vpon wee may alwaies go forward euerlaſting heritage prepared v heauen ſo wee may vanquiſhed temptation may befall v get vpper hand battelles wherwith aſſayled wayting till god haue deliuered v miſeries world taken v vp bliſſedneſſe prepared v heauen wee ſhall haue full contentation may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo c lxviij sermon ſecond vpon xviij chapter 12 ſtrength ſhalbe famine breaking anguiſh ſhalbe ſide 13 firſtborne death ſhall eate vp braunches member skinne yea ſhall eate vp member 14 hope ſhall rooted tent king feare ſhall make come 15 none ſhall dvvell tent brimſtone ſhall bee povvred vpon dvvelling place 16 rootes ſhall vvither bylovve boughes ſhall bee cut aloft 17 name ſhall periſh earth ſhall haue renoume vvhere 18 ſhall caſt light darkneſſe driuen quite vvorld 19 ſhall haue nother sonnes graundchildren among people ouerliuer dvvellings 20 liue ſhall aſtonied day go afore ſhal caught vvith feare 21 surely ſuch tent vvicked place knovveth god wee haue go forwarde matter begunne yeſterday bildad ſheweth god ſuffereth wicked ſcape vnpuniſhed howſoeuer worlde go ſaying true ſaid afore bee rightly vnderſtood wit prouided minde binde god ſuch wiſe wee haue bene wont puniſh wicked maner maner giue leaue execute owne iudgements let v looke vpon followeth bildad ſayeth firſt al famine ſhall ſtrength wicked breaking ſhallbe readie iuſt ſide vvhen ſpeaketh ſtrēgth doubt meeneth abilitie ſhould ſay wicked man nurriſhmēt ſhal turned hunger herevnto agreeth ſecōd part ſtreyne addeth ſides ribbes ſhall nothing elſe burſt aſunder ribbes betoken ſtrength according wee know fleſh alone able beare vp mā vnleſſe ribbes harder ſubſtance wherin conſiſteth al force effect vnderſtād god ſo curſe wicked although ſeeme ſtrōg wel furniſhed al belongs yet ſhal keepe broozing breaking may fare better ſentēce haue mark firſt according scripture man nurriſhed bread euery woorde proceedeth mouth god vvherein moyſes doth v wit abundance haue able ſuſteine v vvhat nothing el grace god pleaſe lorde wee ſhall bee fedde though want bread drink meate according ſayeth wil feede thoſe euen time famine cōtrariwiſe man may haue garner full well ſtored may ſo full till burſt yet ſhall ſuſtenanced euer whit ſhorte god ſhewed manna onely ſuſteyneth v power foode eate bliſſed god ſerue turne manna ſcarcitie god well ſupply againe god bliſsing bee vpon v nothing v good wee muſt needes wexe leane wee muſte needes ſtarue pine away abundance ſentence bildads true ſee many textes scripture agree vvherefore let v learne profite ſelues let v vnderſtād wee haue nother ſtrength ſuſtenance ſpreading god goodneſſe vpon v whiche thing whence drawe lyfe meane wherby wee bee preſerued maynteyned ſtate therefore let v ſettle whole truſt vpon furthermore wee ſee wicked ſtrong lette v aſſure ſelues ſhall laſt euer true wee muſte imagine bildad namely god ſheweth eyeſight thing ſpoken wee muſte tarie paciently giue god leaue execute judgement ſhall thinke good thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne addeth immediatly first borne death ſhall eate braunches member skinne yea ſhall eate member parcell repeted vvhereas mention made firſtborne death behoueth v vnderſtād ſome exquiſite kind death ſome mē die ſee paſſe away eaſily god ſpareth thē otherſome tormented ſuche wiſe pine away peecemeale worne away harde bone otherſome go away without feeling let v marke woord firstborne death carieth great force man hilde vpon racke god diſmayeth frayeth wrappes anguiſh ſides ſomuch ſeeth nothing bottomleſſe pitte horrible feare bildad therefore ſayeth ſhall happen maner wicked true v mortall god hathe put v worlde condition take v hence againe surely cānot come heauēly life except corruptible v firſt put away paule ſpeaketh vvhat muſt done let euery man diſpoſe himſelfe die aſſuring ſelues god doth v ineſtimable grace voutchſafing deliuer v frō corruptiō meanes death although trāſitory lodging body deſtroyed yet reare vp new buyldingin v ſhall much excellēt aſmuch ſhall clothed glorie immortality cōtrarie part let v aſſure ſelues lord ſende firſtborne death vpō wicked ſo death muſt full terrour without cōfort vnaſſwaged miſery ye ſee thing wherein differ vnbeleeuers although v muſt fayn paſſe death togither ſame common men without exception yet notwithſtandinge god reacheth v hande wee come poynt death ſo wee go quiet minde able cōmende ſoules vnto true rightordered truſt hee may receyue good faythfull keeper wicked muſte bee fayne go hence great violence bee troubled diſmayed ſtriue god ſtorme haue nothing may comfort neuertheleſſe let v bethinke v hath bene ſayde namely thing ſhall alwayes apparant ſometime god ſendeth violent death child although body bee payned yet ſoule therefore worſe cace wherein baldad deceyued according wee haue alwayes beare minde wee muſte iudge eyeſight aſmuche god iudgements hidden v wee know god executeth muſt vſe owne wit imagination behalfe howebeit god execute iudgements viſible maner let v marke wee may take good wee ſee well let v vnderſtand hee hath reſerued vtterance till laſt day triall fayth yet meane whyle wee muſt bee fully reſolued although death common men yet faythfull ſo comforted ſtrengthened god goodneſſe come willingly vnto knowing hee receyue according alſo bee ſure keepe ſoules well ſafely vnto latter day ſo much cannot periſh bicauſe hee hath cōmitted thē hād lord ieſus chriſt hath taken protectiō faythfull therfore wil go willingly vnto death contrarywiſe lighteth exquiſite dreadfull death vpon wicked bycauſe firſt knowe whither goe ſecondly god iuſtice purſueth ſuch wiſe cō ceyue nothing feare diſmayedneſſe vvhen heare ſayde priuiledge giuen v wee haue good cauſe thanke good god prepare ſelues liue die pleaſure lette v bee ſtubborne hee goeth take v worlde ſith ſuche comfort prepared v inſueth immediatly hope ſhall bee rooted tent hee ſhall bee brought king death vvhen ſayeth hope vngodly ſhall bee rooted tent thereby done v vnderſtād god time lodge ſuch vnworthie ſo ſhall haue eaſe yea dwell palace whyle meane ſeaſon poore faythfull one ſhall ſcarſely haue little cotage retyre vnto thus deſpyzers god whiche giuen naughtineſſe ſhall dwell worlde though lordſhip thereof belonged none ſhall haue wide large houſes ſhal haue goodly long walk therewithall truſt ſhall bee pleaſures ſay ſhall thinke themſelues ſo well ſettled may neuer ſhaken according alſo ſayde pſalme ſhal repine order nature man looke vpon buyldings make bylowe ſeemeth bee ſo highly aduaunced hand god cannot touche thus yee ſee twoo thing ſhewed v ſentence therefore wee ſee deſpyzers god brauerie iollitie let v abaſhed vvhy ſo late dayes ſuche trade began lorde haue v behold theſe thinges end may know yet come heritage ſaluatiō yet hidden thus muſt troubled offended ſee wicked proſper haue ful ſcope haue fayre dwelling place yea truſt good fortune puffed vp pride haue ſo ſuregrounded hope owne ſeeming may vvhē ſee well newe thing let v marke ſayd hope rooted dwelling place ſay although world ſee thē ſuch p • pe adayes ſo fenced furniſhed ſeeme bee rāpirde al ſides harme may come neere thē incōber thē although worlde ſee well eaſe ſame like cōtinue thē euer yet wil god performe hath ſayde naught hath ſpoken dwelling place hope therein ſhewed v god wil letted execute vengeance vpō thē notwithſtanding ſo highly aduaunced time exempted miſeries worlde ende ſayd ſhall come king feare like mencion made firſtborne death betoken violent death death terrible common death likewiſe bildad ſpeaketh king feare betokeneth royall exquiſite feare ſay greateſt feare found true ſimilitude wee may take diuell king feare natural meening haue touched afore ſurely firſtborne death king feare one maner ſpeeche let v marke briefly wicked threatened driuen ſuch terrible exceſsiue feare feares worlde godly conceiue nothing muſte marke ſentence well god ſende v occaſion care feare wee grieued truly chiefe benefite wiſh lyfe peace ſo wee ſet free exempted miſdoubting carefulneſſe yet notwithſtanding god haue v care wee muſte therefore quiet ouertakē feare although ſame greate yet meane whereby god prouoketh v reſort vnto would neuer come hyde ſelues vnder ſhadowe winges wee ſafe ſure ſides v little child long afrayd ſport play runne euerywhere bee ſcared feare man ſhall get mother lap little chicken would neuer gather themſelues ſo haſtily vnder dammes wing ſcared put feare vvee bee ſo witleſſe wee knowe daunger v wee play ſtray beaſts therefore lorde drawe v home ſendeth v ſuch feare wee bee fayne ſpite teeth acknowledge life vnſure garded god thus ye ſee whereto care feares god ſendeth child tende againe meane make diſtruſt owne ſtrength▪ wee neuer truſt throughly god except diſcouraged ſelues ſo wee knowe become therefore good v bee put feare howbeit wee ſee wicked ſure ſtate lette v bee good cheere reſte inioy muſt ende deerely payde ſhall go king feare ſay ſhall haue ſuche flightings nothing may deliuer ſhall liue extreeme torment anguiſh ſomuch man would bring backe againe god ſhould preuayle ſhould tell ought humble themſelues vntoo god might reſt vpō goodneſſe ſhould vnderſtand whit ment able taſte thereof behold ſay aſtoniſhments wicked dally nowadayes god thus yee ſee effect wee haue remember ſtreyne conſequently ſayde one whiche none ſhall dwell tent brimstone ſhall bee powred vpon houſe men ſet downe ſhall dwell tent howbeit bicauſe none brimſtone ſhal caſt downe vpon harde ſtreyned let v marke bildad ment rather dwellingplaces wicked ſhall periſh elſe conueyed ouer vnto ſtraungers effect meening like textes like ſayd vineyardes landes ſame curſe moyſes pronoū ceth againſt ſuche obey god haue ſerued haue bene vnthankfull rebellious towardes thou ſhalt plant vine ſayeth another man ſhall gather grape thou ſhalt ſowe another ſhal reape thy harueſt thou ſhalt builde houſes ſtrangers ſhall dwell curſe performed wee muſt acknowledge hand god bildad ſayeth poſſeſſe great houſes time ſhal caſt length others ſhall come yea euen thēſelues dwell god wil ouerthrow thē ſhal neede extortioner thruſt thē enimie inuade ſpoyle poſſeſsiōs brimſtone ſhal fall vpō frō aboue ſay god finde meanes vnknowne mē extraordinarie wherby make wicked periſh notwithſtanding ſet vp aloft ſhrynes noman put ye ſee effect conteined true notable ſentence ſo hold v prouiſo hath bene ſet downe ſay muſt beare mind god iudgements go one rate world executed one viſible maner ſenſes may perceyue sometimes god cauſeth child toſſed frō poſt piller ſee nother preſent time paule ſayd without reſte meeneth curſe layd vpon god child ſhould bee alwayes wandering world therby taught ſeeke heritage reſt prepared aboue therefore whereas faithfull birdes vpon bough men ſay ſo wote abide remoued fro executed vpon curſe rather turned wholly welfare ſaluatiō howbeit oft ſee lord leaue wicked deſpyzers woord behoueth v vnderſtand giueth taſte curſe cace againe dwell quietly houſes noman troubleth god hath thunder brimſtone hand ſoone deſtroy although men fauour worlde maynteyne holde vp ſo throughly fenced ſides yet al ſhet gate againſt god may reuendge ſide liſteth immediatly followeth roote ſhall wither beneath boughes bee cut aboue nowe againe bildad dothe v vnderſtand wicked ſhall cōfounded notwithſtanding ſtate ſeeme happie may bee therevnto dothe ſimilitude leade v certeſſe likeneth tree rooted ground marke tree well planted afterward ſpreadeth aboue wel trūke boughes bear leaues floures frute euen ſuch outwarde ſhew wicked deſpyzers god ſuch ſimilitudes well woorthie noted haue declared alreadie muſt greeued al ſee god doth firſt daſhe puniſh thoſe ſteppe vnto euill rather ſeemeth beare good heare petition troubleth v deſires boyle within v ſo would faine god ſhould take vengeance hande much behoueth v marke well ſayde wicked may wel like vnto fayre tree according ſayde 37 pſalme haue ſeene vngodly aduaunced ſo high ſeemed like cedre libanus like ceders higher tree euen ſo wicked among men ſomuch ſeemeth men el ſhould ſtoupe vnder thē went ſayeth dauid kept way came backe againe ſawe print remayning vvhereas ſayeth went meeneth taried paciently til god accōpliſhed worke full time come euen ſo muſt wee ſee wicked proſperitie ſame muſt hinder v following courſe till come thither god calleth v thus yee ſee wee haue marke text firſt poynt secondly behoueth v marke threatening wicked ſhal haue taken deepe roote come ſuch proſperitie likelihood euer winde ſtorme ſhall ſhake ſhall roote wither beneath ſay god worke ſuch ſorte ſhal throwne downe conſumed theyr braunches ſhal cut aboue ſay god perſecute meanes wee ſee let v reſorte promiſes giuen god child according ſayd man feareth god ſhal like tree planted riuers ſide alwayes draweth moyſture nurriſhment ſuch perfect beleefe god like thervnto ſayd leremie therefore let v pray god may draw moiſture thing ſpoken another place pſalmes may fulfilled v namely rightuous ſhall floriſhe palme tree proſper euen houſe lord alſo let v pray lorde nurriſh roote beneath although wee carie outwarde ſhewe men yet may ceaſe haue life hidden chriſte pleaſe giue v countenance ſame may magnifying bliſsing ſo wee may example record goodneſſe pleaſe time cut boughes wil alſo make turne profite man cutteth ſhreddeth vine make beare good fruite afterwarde whereas lette alone would growe wilde let v ſure pleaſe god cut boughes make v yeelde fruite taking away ſuperfluous v thing may turne benefite beſides ſerue alſo reſtreyne v frō tempted pray god make v like wicked▪ wit make v proſper doo thus much concerning ſimilitude alſo ſayd memoriall ſhall periſh earth ſhall haue renowme true muſt put truſt worlde ſeeke renowme glorie holy scripture mocketh ſuch kinde vanitie ſaying ſuch doo ſettle name earth know god kingdome meene therefore wee muſt deſirous make ſelues renowmed worlde yet vaine alſo god hath promiſed bliſsing child name ſhall continue euer ſhall bliſſed bicauſe lorde ſpite churliſhneſſe worlde notwithſtanding make ſeruants honorable good eſtimatiō may deſpized time yea ſubiect many ſlaunders reproches god deliuer length bring paſſe rightuouſneſſe ſhal knowne ye ſee memoriall good men god child ſhall bliſſed true alwayes accompliſhed world yet falleth ſo oftentimes againe whereas god ſpeaketh renowme memoriall meeneth reſpect ſuch haue diſcretion iudge vnbeleuers blinde ignorāt diſcerning god child aright yet doth diminiſh thing promiſſe god maketh v let v come bildads ſaying memoriall wicked ſhall periſh let v marke ſo ſaying curſe peculiarly belongyng deſpizers god according haue touched alreadie bee drunken fooliſh ambitiō ſo beare themſelues hand name ſhall neuer fade worlde men ſhall haue remembrance euer ſee goeth cleane contrarie cauſe turmoyle themſelues ſorte haue men talke vvell deſpyzers god deſirous make themſelues renowmed mouth men god turne quite cleane contrarie remembrance continue ſhall reproche men ſhall ſpeake skorne mockage haue bene caried away ſayd vaine deſire ſee god hath buried ſo menne coulde tell become vvhereas ſeemed ſhould talked worlde indured whereas themſelues ſurmized euery ſhould become greateſt although ſawe many go yet euery thinke himſelfe ſhall chiefeſt yet hath god buried ſayde afore men ſpeake maner euery man made priuie naughtineſſe ſhame doth come ſayd curſe god therfore lette v marke bildad hath expreſſed chiefe thing thoſe kinde men ſeeke whiche giuen worlde ought bee well marked god make name periſh worldward loze wee harme haue wee wee knowe name written booke lyfe glad ſayeth lorde ieſus chriſt diſciples name written god regiſters euerlaſting ſaluation ynough content v vvee like theſe fooles haue none immortalitie make themſelues ſpoken ouergreat fondneſſe wee know god hath written name booke ingroced recorde owne hande ſay owne euerlaſting determination god hande vnchaungeable ordinance hee hath appoynted afterward ratified whole bloud lord ieſus chriſt finally ſealed working holy ſpirite seing wee haue memoriall among angel heauen among patriarkes prophet apoſtles haue wee cauſe concontented ſo albeit remembrance razed worlde yet ſhall wee looze nothing wee ſee god maketh memoriall ſeruants bliſſed ſayd afore notwithſtanding deſpyzed time counted world dirt dung saint paule ſpeaketh likeneth guttes full filthineſſe caſt away thus faythfull exercized time yea vnder curſe men though bare al ſinnes worlde end god maketh rightuouſneſſe ſhine foorth breake day bleſſed remembrāce vve ſee abraham time deſpized ſhaken vvhat may man thinke iacob yet ſee memoriall bliſſed euerie man ranne vpon dauid curſed ſpited became worme ground made skorne mockingſtocke verieſt raſcalles euery man lothe yet notwithſtanding ſee remembrance bliſſed yea euen god churche vnbeleeuers man muſt ſeeke haue renowme remembrance among bicauſe bee wretched blinde ſoules cannot iudge able diſcerne betweene white blacke thus ye ſee haue marke ſentence conſequently heere added ſhall bee cast light darkeneſſe ſhall bee driuen worlde ſhall haue neyther child graundchildrenamong people ſhall haue ouerliuer heyre lande dwell heere bildad confirmeth matter hee treated god make wicked proſper alwayes verie true happineſſe ſtate ſeing laughter muſte turned ſorow let v aſſure ſelues preſent light wicked ſerues leade way darkneſſe vvhen heare wee darkneſſe ſay aduerſitie according alſo worde importeth ſo wote ſide turne v bycauſe beſette ſo many miſeries round aboute wee ſee way well let v parte aſſure ſelues ſame darkneſſe neuer ſo great ſhall pathe leade v god light hee hath wonderfull meanes leade child ſaluation yea euen ſeemeth fully minded deſtroy thē vndone let v aſſure ſelues meanes god draweth v ſaluation wee thicke darkneſſe let v aſſure ſelues well bring v light thus yee ſee wee haue gather vpon text contrariwiſe wee ſee wicked puffed vp nobilitie make great braueries ſpread wing vvell true greate brightneſſe lette v tarie till god performe whiche ſayde heere witte till hee bring darkeneſſe vppon thus wee ſee heere verie profitable thing v knowe whiche although god make wicked proſper tyme cace neuer better alwayes ende muſte bee looked vnto contrarywiſe thoughe poore faythfull one bee diſtreſſed heere ſo wote become ſtate neuer worſe let v looke vpon ende whiche darkeneſſe god meeneth bring light againe whereas ſayde wicked ſhall haue neyther child ofſpring leaue heires dwelling according curſe lawe ſayde iſſue bliſsing god although lorde would benefites life ſhould dedicated vnto men ſhould acknowledge bee authour yeelde prayſe yet notwithſtanding auoucheth ſpeciall benefite giueth men iſſue although law written bildads time yet hee ſame doctrine printed hart god▪ witte lorde roote wicked ſo hee leaue one race al ſhall brought naught man alledge lord doth often ſuffer euen owne child barraine anſwere herevnto ſuch maner curſings oftentimes turned bliſsings vnto god child neyther muſt make generall indifferent rule ſay god doth caces woorke ſayings viſibly eye wee muſte leaue choyce himſelfe diſpoze thereof time place ſhall thinke good vvee may ſee ſometimes faithfull man one feareth god ſhall haue iſſue worlde yet bee ſayde therefore hee cuiſed god beholde firſt rightuous man iſſue left behinde yea promiſe made abraham ofſpring ſhoulde bee ſande sea ſtarres skie hee great number child many child left death true hee diuerſe child beſides iſaac god cutte according alſo woorthie bee abraham child true alſo ſonne iſaac two child one murtherer hart meanes whereof faine put away baniſh houſe vvee ſee although godly leaue child deceaſſe yet therefore leſſe bliſſed god haue euerlaſting fatherhood heauen pleaſeth god ioyne saincts faithfull one angelles alſo wicked bee knowne want iſſue curſe god vnto ſeeming forlorne might haue heyre ſucceede god diſappointeth rightfull vengeance puniſhment meete bicauſe altogither againſt liking wee haue marke ſtreyne furthermore bildad concludeth end ſuch come ſhall amazed ſuche go afore ſhall afrayde ſuch dwelling wicked thoſe feare god ſerueth cōfirme matter witte god puniſh wicked ſuch wiſe worlde ſhall aſtoniſhed ſight ſtate ſhall ſo vnhappie ſaying verie true ought aduaūtage ſelues greatly beare well minde prouided follow bildad incloſing iob ſuche afflicted within ſayde curſedneſſe haue ſayd aduerſities light vpon god child well vpō wicked vvee muſt alwayes beware let god alone guyding thing vnto whome belongeth poore afflicted ſo world eſteemeth v wretch let v therfore ceaſſe reſt vpon goodneſſe god wayte leyſure till deliuer v full adoo oure neceſsities affliction thing referre vnto let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele ſuche wiſe wee may humble ſelues ſorie learne take profite miſeries aduerſities ſent v worlde wee haue done hithertoo vpon knowledge faultes ſinnes wee may enter examination lyfe miſlike vice ende receyued mercie meane lord ieſus chriſt may haue matter occaſion truſt goodneſſe time come ſo whereas wee haue walke many miſeries aduerſities worlde may therfore ceaſſe obey alwayes end may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo c lxix sermon first vpon xix chapter iob anſvvered ſayde 2 hovv long vvill ye greeue hart vndermine vvith vvordes▪ 3 yee haue alreadie ten time put confuſion aſhamed yee hardened agaynſt mee 4 haue done amiſſe ſinne ſhall abide vvith mee 5 magnifie ſelues vaunt ſelues miſerie 6 knovv ye god hath beſeeged vvith povver beſet roūd vvith net 7 crie reaſon violence heanſvvereth ſhreeke yet haue right 8 hath ſhet vp vvay ſo paſſage hee hath put darkneſſe path▪ 9 hath bereft glorie hath taken crovvne avvay head 10 hath deſtroyed mee ſides vaniſhed avvay hath taken avvay hope hope tree 11 anger kindled againſt counteth enimie 12 army come haue incloſed haue pitched camp tent haue ſeene bildads intent rebuking iob tooke general groūd god leaueth wicked vnpuniſhed thervpō concluded iob muſte needes number ſith god afflicted ſo greuouſly iob diſproueth bicauſe men deeme life aduerſities endured forſomuch god puniſheth offence executeth ſome determination ſecrete vnknowne men howbeit come poynt cōplayneth freendes ſo hardharted towardes yee aſhamed ſayth put confuſion ſo often time alreadie haue hardened ſelues agaynst mee haue made ſelues ſtraungers mee hebrew worde may import one wel fitteſt hardned themſelues hauing pitie compaſsion vpon miſeries wee ſee whereto plaint tendeth howbeeit whereas ſayth bee haue done amiſſe ſinne ſhall abyde therein ſheweth himſelf haue bene ouerpaſsionate done amiſſe receyue correction peaceably ſay let alone ſhall beare mine owne puniſhment man ſhall take harme ſin ſelfe maner ſpeaking agreeth vnreclaymable deſperate perſon rather childe god neuertheleſſe iob tempted therevnto ſawe coulde haue reaſon freendes handes yet returneth principall ſtandeth vppon poynt bicauſe euill cace ſayth thinke ye preuayle againſt vaunting ſelues bicauſe ye ſee mee ſuch plight thinke cace paſt recouerie ſhall bee damned bycauſe ye ſee miſerable creature may know yee ſayth god hath ouerthrowne mee iudgement ſay ye muſt diſpute heere reaſon god ruleth himſelfe according man capacitie haue right hand may well contende yet muſt ſtande harmes muſte bee oppreſſed yet crie make moane miſerie neuer aſſuaged booteth hath ſhewed himſelfe bee mine enimie hath ſent innumerable miſeries like armie beſeege mee tormented worſe ſee iſſue way ſeemeth hath incloſed mee locked vp maner meane ſcape miſeries preſſe torment mee verie ſtraunge talke firſt ſight alreadie vnderſtoode partly wherevpon iob groundeth himſelf ſame newly againe brought remembrance ſhall ſhewed anon god leaue let v go forwarde iobs talke complaint maketh freendes iuſt witte pleaſure put confuſion haue ſayde heretofore man ſmitten god roddes although bee iuſt cauſe finde fault yet muſte ſame done milde ſpirite medicine bee ſharpe conſidering hand god hath rigour ynough ſelfe without adding man beare himſelf ſtoutly againſt god ſeeme feele miſerie playeth madman meanes reformable haue vſe greater ſharpneſſe men abuſe god pacience goodneſſe ſuch ſtatelineſſe muſt tamed god handle firſte deſerue ſo become hardeharted wilfull bycauſe hee beareth ye ſee wherein ought vſe greater rigor borne men ſhoulde outface god ſort turne goodneſſe gentleneſſe ſuch poiſon therby inuenim themſelues againſt let man handle mildly runne ryot delight ſo become bewitched man cannot wring reaſon oute drawe repentance man hartbroken ſeene god hath wrought ſuch wiſe alredie ought moued compaſsion matter ſet vpon rigor vvee ſhoulde ſhew ſelues haue māhood v true man afflicted much poſsible yet wee ſee ſtill hardharted againſt god correction hee hath receyued haue amended behoueth vſe rigor yet neuertheleſſe wee muſt ſtill haue pitie miſerie ſee wee kindharted bee ſome mitigation gentleneſſe vſe ſome quiet faſhion nowe iobs freendes ſuche dealing taken thing ought founde humbled himſelf vnder hand god ſurely although ſeemed ſtraunge hādled ſo yet notwithſtanding hee ceaſſed confeſſe god iudge power ouer therevpon fall rayling beare hande cleane contrary truth hee wicked man nothing hypocriſie hee neuer ſerued god hartily whiche afflicted much better rightuouſer hee iob would haue agreed hee muſt haue renounced god ſpoken againſt owne conſcience yee ſee wherevpon hee ſtandeth heereby wee bee taught god afflicteth neyghboures wee muſte conclude worſt men aliue wee muſte haue regard iudge vprightly wee woulde haue men v ſay maye bee god meening trye pacience althoughe haue walked vprightly good zeale yet notwithſtanding hee intendeth wee ſhoulde haue mirroures pleaſe conceale cauſe v haue doone amiſſe god doo puniſhe yet muſte wee meaſure theyr ſinnes puniſhmente wee ſee hee behaueth himſelfe hardly towarde rightuous towarde woorſer ſorte bicauſe hee reſerueth wickeddeſt till ende make vnexcuſable doo nothing elſe heape vp ſtore wrath horrible vengeance vppon theyr owne heades yee ſee howe becommeth v bee wyſe modeſte wee ſee poore men aduerſitie ende wee go wrong way woorke agayne although god ſhewe v finger iuſt cauſe ſendeth ſuche miſeries vpon man let v learne make oure owne profite wee may ſo doo lette v haue eye ſelues god maketh v perceyue iudgementes ſorte intent inſtruct v another man coſte therfore purpoſe v condemne ſuche aduerſitie without hauing regarde oure ſelues behooueth euerie v enter intoo himſelfe bethinke him▪ ala god hath preſerued mee bounde vntoo yea alſo may bee chaſtyzed ſome one waye vvherefore muſte acknowldge god ſpareth mee▪ whereas ſcourged extremitie ſpecially mine eaſe reſte ſame commeth meere mercie ſaye lette v acknowledge theſe thing may haue occaſion bee owne iudges condemne folkes without looking oure ſelues way wee ſee temptation men gyue outwarde wrongfull iudgement v harde keepe meaſure cace ſith iob ſuche pacientneſſe haue ſeene scripture reporteth hath notwithſtanding ouer leaped boundes able ſo brydle himſelfe euill woorde myght ſcape true hath good right complayne yet ſaying vnreclaymable perſone ſay haue doone amyſſe faulte ſhall abyde mee althoughe men bee ſo vnkinde v wee haue doone amiſſe wee ſee ſome haue firye zeale leaſtwiſe ſo mylde harte requiſite yet muſte god child alwayes humble themſelues knowe wee whither god bee priuye mo faultes v wee oure ſelues wote ſurelye wee perceyue tenth parte oure ſinnes god therefore doth ſende v ſome harder chaſtizemente thinke conuenient bycauſe wee knowe oure owne diſeaſe vvee ſee dauid hath ſelfe ſame conſideration towardes semei hee knew well semei lewde fellowe hee ledde agaynſte cankerde bitter minde yet notwithſtanding hee ſayeth tell whyther god hath commaunded rayle ſo vppon mee yee ſee howe dauid conſidereth god hilde handes haue dealt withall ſo rudely nowe wicked men perſecuting v bee bee fathered vppon god bycauſe hee ſerueth turne whippes ſtryke v iuſtlye withall ſhall wee thinke wee ſee men doo good zeale laboure refourme v deſirous oure welfare come v ſuche gentleneſſe requiſite ſhall therfore play looce coltes reiect ſpoken vvhat diſcretion vvee ſhewe well thereby bee gouerned god ſpirite wiſe wee ſee iob tempted ſame maner therfore wee muſte bee wa • er befell ſo man angell heauen praye become v wee keepe good watche againſt satan vvill ſoone put v ſoyle ſurely hee get entrie intoo v wee knowe well whiche ſyde turne v come agayne oure right waye wee bee lette ſentence ſerue v ſuche inſtruction haue ſpoken witte men lifte vp themſelues wiſe againſt v feerce vpon v bee ſo modeſt requiſite yet notwithſtanding behoueth v vnderſtande alwaies welfare receyue correction layde vpon v humbling ſelues lette v learne enter oure ſelues let v neyther fret repine men rebuke v ſomewhat ſharpely diſcouer lewdneſſe vvherefore men wee ſee doo oftentymes ſtorme without rule modeſty bicauſe haue eye vnto god partie appeached woulde conſider verely haue done amiſſe finde ſelfe blame worthy may well excuſe ſelfe afore mē let mee iuſtifie ſelfe let mee bleare eye ſelfe neyghbours let mee imagine haue greate wrong done mee ala yet ſcape hand god vvhat ſhall gayne ſeeking many krinkes excuſing ſelfe worldwarde lo god condemne mee moreouer matter ſtandeth ſimply vpon beeing cyted heauenly iudge beholde mine owne conſcience doth ſo cry vpon mee carie iudge hangman mee ſith ſo better mee yeeld ſelfe guiltie caſte downe head conſider god ſeeth thing aſmuch handleth ſo ſhoulde acknowledge ſame fit medicine although ſeme bitter mee could find hart refuze poſsible yet behoofe yeeld yee ſee wee haue marke ſentence furthermore let v learne quickſighted eſpying owne faultes god viſiteth v aſſuring oure ſelues ſo dooing ſheweth v ſingular fauour wee ſee howe inclined nature hypocriſie thervpon euery v doth ſo flatter foade himſelfe owne ſinnes wee preuented ſide none v hee woulde welter owne filthineſſe woulde become ende vve ſhall runne euill worſe till satan get full poſſeſsion v ſhall wee bee ſo caryed awaye ſhall remayne nothing blockiſhneſſe v according ſayde prouerbes sainct paule ſpeaketh alſo behold extremeſt miſeries men haue remorſe ſo carryed away gyuen vp handes satan wounded feele ſinnes bewayle god ſurely ſhould v come poynte god withhild v ſtirring vp men nowe inforce v feele oure ſinnes diſcouering wee haue forgotten thinke well hidden putting v minde whereas wee haue turned oure backes vpon iudge behooueth v come therefore ſayde yee ſee heere benefite bee deſpized wee refuſed correction put v one wee laboured quench light god ſpirite vvee bee darkeneſſe ſo long ſinnes hidden god commeth lyght v vp creſſet giue v lyght ſee owne wantes yet wee leuer haue kercheefes blindefolde ſelues withall cannot finde oure harte haue taken away wee refuze light lyke better darkeneſſe praye vnthankefulneſſe pray deteſtable ſacriledge wee reſiſte god ſpirite ſorte reacheth v hande willing bring v backe waye ſaluation yee ſee ſpeciall poynt wee haue marke ſentence wee muſte ſay haue doone amiſſe ſhall beare mine owne burthen men ſhall ſuffer puniſhment mee ſay lette v ſtryue faſhion lette v conſider god gyueth giftes others communicate vntoo v hee ſendeth v man ſhewe v oure faultes recorde goodneſſe hee hath ſtyll care v deſirous reſerue v himſelfe verie deede wee bee reſtie kicke agaynſte ſpurre reiecting correction offered v men manner vnthankefulneſſe ſhooteth god himſelfe whome wrong done hee alſo ſhall reuenge therefore let v keepe oure ſelues falling ſuche pryde let v bethinke v whenſoeuer haue done amiſſe high time v come home oure ſelues conſider oure owne euill may bee remedyed nowe lette v come ſeconde poynte whiche chiefe hath bene declared heeretofore iob vtterly refuze correction caſt foorth theſe wordes blaſte winde hath beene noted heeretofore booke iob ſpeaketh onely hee fully reſolued himſelf alſo vttereth fittes affection mooued inwardely howbeeit withſtode reſtreyned ſo hee ſorie afterwarde nowe therefore hee giueth ouer hee ſayde paſsing commeth principall poynte hee knewe wandering talke grounded eyther vppon reaſon truthe returneth hee defence cace whiche freendes vnder coloure comforting doo vaunte themſelues agaynſte yea theyr vaunting themſelues withoute alleadging thing reproofe put confuzion came thither ſuche harde ſhameleſſe harte neyther manhoode modeſty thus ye ſee iobs meening hee concludeth alwaies god dooth puniſhe ſinnes hee handleth ſtraunge faſhion ſuche men acquaynted ſurely heere hee complayneth hee crye reaſon bycauſe god enimie heereby wee taught firſte wee doo oure neyghboures good rebuking faultes behooueth v bee well ſure haue done amiſſe finde faulte iuſtly vpon ſingle coniectures euill manner proceeding iobs freendes condemne bicauſe god ſcourged vve muſte another minde haue ſayde alreadie god keepeth alwayes one rate puniſhe none ſuche haue doone amiſſe nay rather oftentymes rightuouſeſt troubled muche others wee ſee according god hath dealte power vnto ſo doth hee alſo trie vttermoſte behooueth v beare well minde ende wee bee greeued wee ſee wee muſte walke ſelfe ſame waye doo ought miſlike v god ſpareth v thoſe whome hee loued men vvoulde wee bee priuiledged holy father haue ſo excellent wytneſſe holie ghoſt▪ wee ſhoulde condemne acquitte euerie man according god handling poore folke worlde ſicke folke deſpyzed folke folke oute credite eſtimation ſhoulde bee wicked men dealing thoſe god chooſeth bee thoſe whome acknowledgeth auoucheth bee child contrariwiſe placed honour dignitie god aduaunceth faſhion intente theyr fall ſhoulde bee deadlyer ſpecially abuſe gifte suche haue rich ſo ſwallowed vp bee entring hell become ſo drunken theyr proſperitie▪ ſo vaunte themſelues agaynſte god goodes whiche poſſeſſe crie vengeance againſt vve ſee ſuche ſtrongeſt like ſtubborne horſes cannot bee broken brought handſomneſſe ſhort ſeemeth nothing elſe thē rage agaynſt god thus yee ſee ouerſpitefull frowarde iudgement therefore let v learne holde ſuche euen hande wee condemne men god lawe ſuch time bee ſure faultes ſo wee may diſcerne perſons let v alwayes reſerue god hande vntill appeare ſome certaine marke god hath reiected let v parte haſtie take vpon vs▪ thing lawefull thus yee ſee haue ſticke ſentence neuertheleſſe haue ſayde alreadye iobs meening true witte hee puniſhed ſinnes yet followeth therfore hee ouerſhot himſelfe paſsions oughte alwayes humble v wee ſee ſuche man indued ſo great grace able holde himſelfe ſwaruing aſide ſhall become nowe according heerevntoo hee ſayeth god ouerthrowen ſay hee commeth agaynſte ſuche diſordered manner altoogither oute ſquare hath indifferencie may ſpoken ſuch ſenſe ſhall bee euill haue declared heeretoofore god double rightuouſneſſe one whiche hee hath ſette foorth lawe rightuouſneſſe well knowen apparant v oure rule lyue yet another higher rightuouſneſſe god whiche ſecrete hydden v wee ſhall haue fulfilled whole lawe whiche impoſsible doo wee wyll put cace doone yet haue wee ſatisfied god according perfect rightuouſneſſe wee ſhall haue contented according ſeruice hee requireth v according abilitie oure humayne nature meene ſuch abilitie wee haue ſince adam ſynned ſuche wee oure creation god put cace wee aungelles go too▪ wee myghte fulfill lawe god▪ anſwerable ſouerayne rightfulneſſe farre hygher oure vnderſtanding able reache vntoo proportionableneſſe betwixte oure lorde dooth nowe puniſhe men theyr ſinnes euen according curſes hee hath ſet foorth lawe otherwhiles hee hath ſuche reſpecte puniſhing reſerueth intente owne ſecrete purpoſe wee ſee afflicting iob bee demaunded wee haue ſoughte vttermoſte wee ſhall finde bee ſinnes therefore muſte needes bee ſome cauſe vvee ſee trouble iacob indured yet hee ſerued god purely ſay yee father abraham iſaac ſhoulde ſeeme god conſpired agaynſt make paſſe aduerſities miſeries coulde bee deuized muche bee ſayde dauid vvas diſordered men deſerued rigorous puniſhment yee ſee god hath ſecrete iudgementes whiche hydden v tyme therefore iobs meening heere affliction whiche hee endureth muſte bee taken one common puniſhments implyed thretnings god hath publiſhed lawe hygher cauſe whiche bee knowen men surely iob ſimply reſpecte hee good reaſon ſo dooing hee ſayeth god ouerthrowen order hee ſheweth himſelfe bee ouermayſtred affection true hee alwayes knewe god rightuous according wee ſee although hee ſhaken ſuche woordes eſcaped yet hee returneth home againe acknowledgeth ought holde mouthe ſhette neuertheleſſe hee cea •• eth haue skumme boyling pot ſeetheth vp greate walloppes muſte needes ſpirt ouer one ſide euen ſo doth iob behooueth v knowe hee ſtormeth muche agaynſt god whiche thing greatly oure profite apply inſtruction touching firſte place wee ſhall haue profited greatly wee beare away leſſon god dooth ſometymes puniſhe men reſpecte theyr ſinnes humble bycauſe intente ſhewe hee hathe full authoritie ouer creature hathe ordeyned mirroures pacience bycauſe hee wyll make feele theyr owne infirmity maye knowe themſelues better perceyue bee couert vice diſcouered affliction haue ſuche conſtancie requiſite haue ſwarued aſyde ſhall haue ſeene themſelues ſo ſtumbled maye bee prouoked call vpon god knowing reached thē hand bin vtterly vndone ſurely whenſoeuer indure affliction beſt remedy v enter knowing ſinnes euery man accuſe himſelfe ſaying▪ ala haue offended god ſo many wayes ſhould puniſh mee hundred folde haue deſerued much agayne wee ſee alwayes wherefore god ſcourgeth v let v ſay vvell lorde thou art rightuous although bee able atteyne reaſon thine intent ought ſuffize mee knowe thou doeſt thing rightly indifferently lette v aſſure ſelues wee haue true wiſedome wee ſo glorifie god notwithſtanding hee holde oure eye cloſed vp leade v poore blinde ſoules let v bee contented walke whitherſoeuer leadeth directeth v aſſuring ſelues onely wyll muſte bee v infallible rule right whereas wee ſee iob ſo ouermayſtred affection let v vnderſtande right harde thing v ſubmitte ſelues ſingle god without asking reaſon woorkes ſpeciallie thoſe woorkes ſurmounte witte capacitie ſayde afore namely perfect angelicall wiſedome haue skill yeelde ſo muche honour vntoo god reſt meerely ſimply vpon pleaſure although wee finde matter ſtraunge ſeeming vtterlye contrarie ryght reaſon yet wee bowe downe heades ſaye lorde although thy iudgementes bee deepe gulfe yet wee preſume encounter truely iob fully diſpozed ſo doo yea althoughe hee rough aſſaults temptation yet ende got victorie neuertheleſſe wee ſee hee ſwarued ſaying god hath ouerthrowen iudgement ſay handleth mee lyke iudge ſteppeth mee extraordinarie rigoure thoughe hee compaſsion mee seeyng iob tempted ſo farre ſhall becomme v therefore lette v applye oure wytte oure indeuoure leſſon namelye reſte ſimply meerely vpon good god tarrye vpon temptation althoughe cary v ſometimes away holde ſelues ſhorte reyne ſelues bridle wee ſee god playeth iudge v mortall men auaunce themſelues agaynſt maker cannot find theyr hate ſubmitte themſelues hee ſendeth although proteſt cleane cōtrary yet doings ſhewe blame god crueltie woulde fayne go lawe thus yee ſee haue beare mynde iob muſt ſerue v ſuche example ſith wee ſee exceſſe pang howbeeit wee compare thoſe ruſhe intoo diueliſhe boldeneſſe wee ought yet better warned humble oure ſelues howe vve ſhall ſee manie like vntoo iob onely haue pang twayne chafing alſo continue euill woorſe matter falleth theyr minde firſte fall murmuring agaynſt god afterwarde take libertie chafe meete vneaſie ſaying theyr headineſſe ſuche make bone auaunte themſelues agaynſte god yea bee wilfull vttermoſte wee ſee theſe ſelfewize folke doo inſomuche thing holye scripture agreeth theyr witte fooliſhe brayne muſte bee condemned▪ firſt daſhe without ſcanning whence ſame proceedeth afterwarde although bee conuinced yet ceaſſe ſo ſhameleſſe lifte vp themſelues agaynſt god agaynſte ſecrete incomprehenſible iudgementes ſay tuſhe impoſsible enter heade vvell freende bee blinde sunne therefore darke ſhineth blinde man ſay ſee lyght muche ſay sunne doth darkē men well matter therefore ſith wee ſee diuell caryeth away men ſuche rage conclude theyr reaſons agaynſte god ſo muche ſtandeth v hand indeuer bridle ſelues ſhort impaciency erewhiles prouoke v pricke v forward bee angry god fret ſelues leaſtwiſe yet wee haue well ſtormed lette v come home againe better turne late neuer let v ſay lorde would become mee thou hilde mee backe euen ſo god behooueth gouerned thy ſpirite thou giue mee wiſedome bee wholly ſubiect thy good whatſoeuer may betyde mee lo haue marke moreouer let v alſo compare miſeries iobs wee conſider well affliction indured bee ſo ſtraunge hee myght well ſay know may take for▪ god oppreſſeth mee ouerſore proofe hereof god touche v little finger wee bee ſo tender angrie fall ſaying howe go geere god ſende v common diſeaſe beare ſelues hande hee ought rather haue ſpared v hee afflict v wiſe wyll make v ſtorme bee ſhorte lette giue v one laſhe rodde wee ſaye hee hath thundred vpon v seeing ſo impacient let v conſider iob indured woulde become v ſhoulde come ſame poynt vvoulde caſt vp ſome skumme aſſwage againe nexte way ſette v quite ouer oure ſhoes ſith wee bee ſo inclined therevnto vppon euery ſmall occaſion muche therefore behooueth v knowe wee haue profited god ſchoole tyll wee haue learned take paciently correction ſendeth v ſeeing tend welfare thus yee ſee wee note vpon ſentence howbeeit among thing lette v marke harde verye daungerous temptation god heareth cryes complayntes ſayde god name ſtrong ſure hold ſuche flee vnto vvhoſoeuer calleth vpon name lorde ſhall ſaued yea although heauen earth medled togither whole order nature confounded yet ſhoulde ſtill preſerued calling vppon name god • oel ſayeth god hath promiſed heare v opē mouth reach hande helpe v ſpeake ye ſee god ſheweth himſelfe ſo bountifull yea would maruell aſſuring v ſuccour neceſſitie yet ſhall haue called vpon twice wee ſhall haue perſiſted praying haue pitie vpon v wee ſhall continue ſtill one ſtate whiche woorſe ſhall ſeeme v god ſharpeneth himſelfe agaynſte v torment v haue called vpon temptation ſayde mee name god refuge god neere vnto call vppon faithfully haue aſſayed thoſe promiſes meane feele cōmoditie rather miſerie increaſed thing yet notwithſtanding iob came poynte iob onely alſo dauid reſte faythfull ſpecially behoueth ſame thing bee fulfilled oure lorde ieſus chriſte according alſo whome ſentence veryfied namely crye vntoo thee daye nyght yet thou eaſeſt mee miſeries thou ſeemeſt haue forſaken mee oure father reſorted thee alwayes perceyued vayne thou putteſt mee heere confuſion hereby wee note although god haue promiſed bee neere vntoo call vppon ſuccoure open theyr mouthes deſire yet dooth importe hee ſheweth alwayes eye hys owne manner certaine wee call vppon god hee willing readie helpe v proofe heereof whence commeth affection praying commeth holie ghoſte man woulde neuer owne minde reſort vnto god bycauſe god looketh vnto v pity thinke hath turned back vpon v agayne haue ſtoode vp tyme muſte needes bee power whiche hee gaue v ſuccouring v hande made v bee pacient lowly aduerſities true may haue ſuche conceyte maye ſeeme v tyme god hath gyuen eare v vvee ſee howe ſo iob dauid yea ieſus chriſte alſo fayne come poynte hee tempted maner ſay impacience yet notwithſtanding bicauſe hee fight agaynſte owne humaine nature hee fayne ſuffer anguiſhe minde foraſmuche god lefte deſtitute helpe hee inforced crie god god haſte thou forſaken mee therefore wee haue ſuche temptation greeued reaſon infirmity greate ſtore vice v according wee full diſtruſte ſtubbornneſſe pryde like thing let v haue recourſe vnto poynte bee firſte whome god hath minded ſuccoure haue ende felte profyte theyr prayer notwithſtanding languyſhed vnder hande tyme let v hold oute ſuffer god keepe v languyſhing long pleaſeth euen tyll hee haue delyuered v ſhewed himſelfe oure sauioure full according hee hath gyuen v ſome taſte already worlde nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemēt ſines praying ſo clenze v may nothing v hinder v comming right foorth vnto comming wee may finde ready receyue v lorde ieſus chriſtes ſake ſo let v ſaye almighty god heauenly father c lxx sermon ſecond vpon xix chapter sermon conteyneth expoſition 7 8 9 10 11 12 verſes haue bene touched alreadie vpon texte followeth heere 13 hee hath made brother ſhrinke avvaye mee myne acquayntance become ſtraungers mee 14 neighbour haue forſaken mee father mother haue forgotten mee 15 mine ovvne houſholde may deſeruantes haue diſdeyned mee haue beene ſtraunger theyr ſight 16 call ſeruant hee anſvvereth mee though pray vvith mine ovvne mouth behoueth v go matter beganne laſt sermon whiche harde burdenſome temptation whē prayer heard firſte verely onely thing remayneth v aduerſitie god receiue v deſire hee haue pitie vpon v wee maye feele reſorting h • ſuccour hath beene vayne thus ſay welfare comforte faithfull ſeeme wee haue loſte time running god bee ayded hande become shall wee bee good deſpayre yet god pleaſure exercize child manner hyding himſelfe making countenaunce hearing
