regarding miſeries indure true hath promiſed bee readie helpe v ſoone wee deſire yea hee tarie bee ſued vntoo preuente oure requeſtes maketh temptation muche greeuouſer namely god ſeemeth haue dallyed v haue gyuen v vayne fruteleſſe hope let v vnderſtande ſeeing hath exerciſed child ſo heretofore muſt maruell though like v nowadayes vvherfore let v wait paciently ſhall ſee ende hath forgotten v ne ceaſſeth heare v althoughe hee ſhewe oute hande open ſyght worlde hee hath hande ſtretched ouer v doubte wee bee pacient able continue prayer token god hath heard v alreadie hee preſerued v manner poſsible v haue continued one minute houre hath beene declared behoueth v come euill v cauſe god delayeth helpe dryueth time pray ſo hartily requiſite euery man ſaye hee paſſeth praying deede men bee asked whyther haue doone indeuer pray god haue mercie vpon euerie one anſwere haue prayed muche poſsible ſpeake manner knowe prayer meeneth vvee go coldly thing wee thinke god ought receyue ſuche requeſtes made faſhion ſake ceremoniouſly onely let v marke god ſeeyng coldeneſſe negligence aydeth v ſo ſoone wee deſire intente quycken v inflame v greater deſire ſame meanes oure fayth may bee better tryed elſe wee pray god ſorte bee negligence oure prayer yet wyll bee ſome rebelliouſneſſe hydden v wee ſee heere iob true iob prayed ſuche mildeneſſe meete hee rather impacient ſorte muſte wee go vntoo god sainct paule gyueth v rule ſaying wee muſte pray inceſſantly gyuing thankes although wee tormented ouerpreſſed aduerſities yet muſte wee ceaſſe ſighe grone yea therewithall alſo continuallye bliſſe name god oure prayer ſubmit oure ſelues vntoo bee wanting praying rather defying god man ſhoulde go ſummon enimie defye yee ſee oure prayer ſometymes like vntoo ſummonings according wee make vntoo god howe greateſt honour god requireth handes wee ſhoulde call vppon aduerſities nowe ſteede dooing homage come ſpyte therefore wee muſt thinke ſtraunge hee ſhoulde ſtoppe eares agaynſte oure prayer make countenaunce helpe v wee crye vppon lette v haue theſe two thing witte lette v pray god earneſt minde ſo may bee onely liplabour caſting foorth ſome ſighes aduenture beſeeching bottome harte ſecondly lette bee pryde v bee deſirous make god ſubiect v ſo hee ſhoulde whatſoeuer commeth heade fancie let v pray vnto lowlineſſe magnifiyng prayſing although hee afflict v vvhen haue theſe two thing certayne wee ſhall bee hearde ſo muche rather contrarie vice cauſe god doth ſo muche delay helping v let v put cace god ſuccoure v wee haue prayed duetifully ſuche hartineſſe hee himſelfe requireth yet muſte wee ſtill bee pacient till conuenient tyme bee come whiche hande onely iudge wee knowe day prayer haue auayled v god make v perceyue morrowe vvherefore lette v ſtande dumbe behalfe wayte ſuche opportunitie ende god ſhall liſte ſende v ſhall ſame bee good luckie welfare thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſentence iob ſayeth hee cryed yet wasnot bearde adding complaine affliction ſo extreeme woonder though hee bee exceedinglye ſore greeued freendes ought ſtande checking agaynſte follie ſayeth hee deeme ordinarie cuſtome ought doo man bee afflicted tolde hee ought pray vnto god mee ſayeth hee pray vntoo hearde man reply agayne frende muſte ſtorme ſo ſore peraduenture aduerſitie hee indureth ſome common thing ſayeth hee feele ſuche ſo exceſsiue payne hande god preſſeth mee ſo ſtraunge rigorous manner maruell thoughe bee neyther witte reaſon mee lo iobs meening haue tolde heeretoofore howe behooueth v knowe god dooth ſometimes execute rigoure vppon men vnknowen manner reſpect oure mother witte therefore muſte wee ſuche tymes pray vnto god ſay lorde make mee perceyue continuallye thou art hande mee although finde experience rather forſaken thee outward ſeeming yet giue mee power alwayes ſettle hope vppon thy goodneſſe ſuccour iob ſhoulde haue ſpoken ſo howbeeit foraſmuche hee doth therefore hee roueth ouer feelde ſay making ſuch complaint wee heare texte intent doo oure ſelues good whiche conteyned heere lette v marke iobs perſon holie ghoſt mente ſette v oute glaſſe men affection bee brydled vnder god obeyſance marke one poynte another poynte god mente heere ſhewe v iudgementes howe terrible hee liſteth hyde louing countenaunce v ſhewe himſelfe enimie men ſo dreadfull thing ynough ouerwhelme whole worlde ſeconde poynte thirde althoughe iob ſuche pangues yet notwithſtanding hee reſiſted temptation howbeeit came ſooner brunte many euill woordes ſcaped ſo infirmitie mingled ſtrength thus yee ſee three thing wee haue marke heere firſte wee note god haue men beholde themſelues perſon iob wee ſhould knowe wee god inforced v perceyue oure owne weakeneſſe euerye man thinkes himſelfe bee mightie ſtrong wee imagine oure owne power woonderfull ſhall neuer ſwarue yea ſo long wee bee farre blowes aſſoone god preſſeth wee bee ſo caſt downe wee may well ſee dull vayne fooliſhe ouerweening v wee thought wee ſtrength oure ſelues wheras wee haue none aſmuche therefore men ſo blynded ſotted fooliſhe perſwaſion holy ghoſt preſenteth heere vntoo v perſone iob make v perceyue howe men ſhrinke vnder god hande bee afflicted cannot ſtande muſte needes bee vtterlye ouerthrowne nowe happened iob conſtant aboue others ala ſhall become v wee muſte come ſecond poynt chiefeſt whereof commeth wee bee teachable humble ſelues god walke awe withoute truſting oure ſelues thing wee doo bicauſe wee feele howe heauie vntollerable god hande matter god declareth vnto v terrible cace hee lyſteth vtter power vpon mortall men puniſhing muſt needes melte ſnowe agaynſte sunne bee vtterly confounded yea verely scripture ſayth god needeth vtter rigoure vpon v let onely withdrawe ſpirite ſaye liuelyneſſe wherewith hee quickeneth v beholde wee bee gone hee ſayeth onely hee wyll bereeue v power alſo become contrary v fall vpon v thunder tempeſt ouerwhelme v ala wee true wee confeſſe impoſsible mortall men holde tacke god aſſayleth yet wee conceyue requiſite howe dreadfull god hande ought bee v thus yee ſee example ſhewed v heere iobs perſone way haue touched afore wee muſte ſuppoſe iob delighted foaded himſelfe ſuche paſsions euill damnable howe hee ſtryued withſtande yet ſo fayle good ſhaken downe god intended ſhewe men neuer ſo vertuous ſomewhat bee miſlyked euer ſhew themſelues weake ſome ſorte greatly oure profite ende wee ſhoulde bee diſcouraged wee bee tempted thoughe ſeeme wee ſhall bee vtterly ouerwhelmed wee finde oure ſelues cace lette v paſſe pray god holde v vp lette v doubte hee ſithe wee ſee althoughe iob infirmity fleſh yet notwithſtanding hee fayled victorie ſaye let v doubt god wyll ſo woorke hee wyll make v ouercome oure temptation yea ſhall bee withoute making v lympe without gyuing v ſome blowes without making oure woundes bleede lette ſuffize v ſtrokes whiche wee receyue deadlye god wyll ſteppe v buckler nowe lette v come complayntes iob maketh heere ſayeth god bath ſo beſeeged wayes hee knoweth howe get hee hath put darkeneſſe pathe though wee bee afflicted yet greate aſſwagemente oure greefe wee ſee miſhappe muſte paſſe awaye apace continue ſtyll finde ſome meanes ſcape ſhifte mennes counſell bee taken v remayneth nothing deſpayre iob meeneth heere hee ſayeth god hathe clozed vp wayes whiche one hee ſayde ala ſhall become wretched man tormented many miſeries looke whiche way get one way yet another hee ſeeke meanes aske counſell cace ſtandeth ſo mee god hath ſhet mee vp heere ſee waye may well reaſon obteyning releefe mee nothing darkeneſſe ſay ſee neyther waye pathe god hath ſo inclozed mee word remedy ſumme ſpoken heere behoueth v marke wel ende like happen vnto v wee may leaue call vpon god vvhat cauſe men ſhet dore blow come able pray vtterly amazed bicauſe beare themſelues hande like neuer happened man afore truely wee haue ſeene alredy iob aſſaulted ſuch temptation looke vpon faithful haue bin thee euer god handled thē faſhion plaine concluding iob forlorne vtterly caſt away ye ſee texte well worthy marked time ſeeme vnto v miſeries wee indure endleſſe neuer rid wee haue ſought wayes woode ſeemeth impoſsible euer ſhoulde ſet free agayne let v ſay well god knoweth drawe v perplexitie therefore let v ſtande vpon poynt yea likely god ſhould pitie v vvee ſee like hath happened iob let v looke vnto ende iames ſayeth ſeeyng god deliuered man miſeries indured ſhoulde hee ſuccoure v alſo daye nother might abated goodneſſe yee ſee vſe behooueth v applie ſentence iobs hee ſayeth god ſhut vp wayes furthermore let v marke god doth erewhiles time bereeue faithfull benefytes hath promiſed intent ſhoulde bee prouoked pray alſo hee intendeth humble hee chaſtizeth ſinnes iob certayne hee ſuffered offence hee committed god founde ynough wherefore puniſh haue declared heeretofore bycauſe hee reſpect onely rather meent trye pacience v hee depriue v bliſsings hath promiſed v haue offended woorthy enioy elſe daſhe ſpurre whiche hee gyueth v make v praye vnto earneſtly thus dothe god promiſe faithfull guide way yea lend thē angel bee guide ſo ſhall ſtep one pace awry incoūtered euill goodly promiſe yet notwithſtāding ſeeme vnto v way ſhut vp nothing brābles buſhes afore v nothing mountaines rockes round v thus incloſed likelihode poſsibilitie get vvhat haue cace ſay ala worthy god ſhold performe goodneſſe hath promiſed child ſhould haue way plaine leuel know ſide ſtep therfore behoueth acknowledge fault truly god hath promiſed ſend angelles guide faithfull one ſeemeth cleane otherwiſe therfore behoueth pray voutſafe ſhew performance promiſe towardes thus ſuche meanes ſtirred vp call vpon god heerewithall let v vnderſtand hee berceue v skill diſcretion vnto ende make v finde waye none woorking ſhall bee ſo muche better knowen vnto v whereby wee ſhall haue greater occaſion glorifie whē ſhall haue wrought ſuch manner looked god hath gone beyonde oure witte hope haue ſo much cauſe glorifie thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke ſentence iob addeth god bereft glory plucked crowne heade hee conſumed destroyed berefte hope tree cut vp heere iob betokeneth two thing one god ſcourgeth ſo roughly hee compared men ſhoulde founde indure much ſecondly ſaieth aduerſitie though ſuffer greate miſerie yet notwithſtanding tree plucked vp yet hath ſome little roote ſtring left behinde ſo yet ſtill ſome hope ſaith plucked vp ſuche ſorte remaineth piece mee god ſeemeth haue ſtubbed mee vp quite cleane although yet rooted world yet life like deathe yea god giuen ſo many woundes lighted miſeries calamity vpon child bene curſed deathe goodes bene taken awaye deſtroyed bodie become rotten carkeſſe therefore cauſeleſſe hee ſayeth god cut vp berefte hope like tree plucked vp quite cleane grounde ſo remained nothing ſtrength thereof fadeth awaye bee hoped ſpring vppon earth bring foorth frute bicauſe hath loſt freſhneſſe iob ſayeth hee dealt like wiſe heare theſe thing muſte maruell ſo ſore greeued ſeemed nothing myghte comforte whiche v would impacient indured hundreth part indured yet perceiue god ſtood muſt hope hee much towardes v vvhat cauſe impaciencie oftentimes v like wee deſire bee pacient aduerſities behooueth v take comforte fauoure god ſo alſo contrarie part cannot abide god ſhould ſmite v ſo teſtie ſeeming nother order reaſon dooyng go oure hope wrecke euen ſo happened iob diſpleaſed god ouerſhooting himſelfe ſuche wyſe wee haue ſeene alſo long himſelfe hee caſte downe headlong deſpaire deſerued well god ſhoulde haue rooted berefte hope made tree plucked vp roote rind ſpeaking ſuche ſort wee ſee iob ſo bereft god grace hee bin vtterly vndoone plunged hell god reached hand farre let v aſſure ſelues god ſingular goodneſſe ſuffered ſeruaunte fall euen bottomleſſe pitte thereby admoniſhed god neede mainteine v yea lift v vp againe falne god woorketh two ſortes towards v ende ſhould call vpon sometimes hee preſerueth v ſuche wiſe power wee fall ſometimes ſuffereth v fall end lift v vp againe afterward yet notwithſtanding true muſte tempt god giue v bridle like frantike folke vnder coloure hath well holpen vp ſuche haue falne ſhoulde wee abuſe grace agayne becommeth v magnifie gracious goodneſſe towards iob aſſuring ſelues wee bee good quyte quayled hee commeth v ſeekes v needefull ſhoulde worke ſort otherwiſe ſhould vndone euery blowe wee ſee heere fayre lookinggleſſe thus much concerning ſaying furthermore wee may withſtand ſuche temptation let v marke oure life muſt hidden paule alſo ſpeaketh true like tree pulled vp yet doth god ceaſſe giue v ſecret ſtrength wee ſhall haue continuall freſhneſſe notwithſtanding wee ſeeme periſhed thē let v eſteeme life welfare behold may diſcerned eye ſight motherwitte let v vnderſtande god intendeth preſerue v meane whiche wee able cōprehend life ſayth paule hidden lord ieſus chriſt therfore let v waite vpō good god pray giue v grace looke alwaies vnto till time come diſcouer nowe vnknowen behoueth v bee like dead men vntill ſuch time god quicken v vve may well feele beneath ſome taſt grace hee may well giue v experience yet feele time wee muſte pray waken v make v know loue beareth v although haue paſte one drop god grace yet muſte wee call minde paule ſayth romanes god ſpirite liue v although little portion yet ſufficient put away euer v oure owne wicked nature vvell true ſhall alwaies feele nother ſhall perceyue working god ſpirite v let v pray god ſuffer ſuch dulneſſe blockiſhneſſe dwell alwayes v ſhoulde feele grace apply ſuch vſe would haue v profite ſelues lo haue marke ſecōd place vpon ſtreyne iob ſayth afterward god hath inflamed wrath become enimie true oft god ſcourgeth v holy ſcripture ſayth angry v ſubiect paſſions nother hee caſteth v away hee hateth v deede vvhat bicauſe make v feele diſpleaſure affliction vvhy ſo afflictiōs god chaſtizemēts ſendeth vnto mē ſinnes true haue ſayd alredy ſomtimes chaſtizeth ſeruantes ſome purpoſe yet muſt alwayes firſte call minde bee ſinners detters vnto god therefore hee puniſheth ſinnes wee haue committed howbeeit iobs ſaying particular conſideration beyonde ordinarie woont complayneth god anger kindled agaynſt ought noueltie throughout holy ſcripture god declareth auoweth himſelfe bee angrie thoſe whome hee chaziſeth yea iob intended expreſſe wrath god common accuſtomed wrath though god counted vtter caſtaway like generally god haue v feele anger hee puniſheth v enter knowledge owne ſinnes ſo alſo haue v knowe ſame wrath laſteth paſſeth fadeth away ſaid prophete eſay turning hande make thee feele diſpleaſure mercie wil make thee feele generation generation ſhall indure towardes thee euerlaſtingly ye ſee euen middes affliction behoueth v one ſide know god angrie bycauſe wee haue offended ſinnes ſide doubt loueth v deſirous one v iob declareth god hilde enimie ſay anger god ordinarie anger ſheweth himſelfe angry ſinners giueth ſome token vengeance hee exceſsiue ſenſe ſaying nowe woulde become v ſame cace hee without comfort haue declared afore impoſsible v pacient coulde ſhould needes rebell agaynſt god knew goodneſſe ende thou mayeſt feared ſayth dauid thou lord art louing men cannot find hart beleeue god pitifull towards much leſſe humble themſelues nay rather grinde teethe againſte nowe may ſeeme iob comforted beleeued god would deſtroy hee vtterly throwne alreadie plight might haue ſhewed heeretofore declareth former pang wherein paſſed meaſure howbeeit hee withſtood ende ſee ſhift haue pray god hee ſuch wiſe ingraue harte promiſe hee hath made whole church may neuer eſcape v ſayde promiſe whenſoeuer ſhall haue ſinned whenſoeuer ſhall haue ſwarued commaundements chaſtize v ſhall rod man ſay chaſtize v gently mylde faſhion mercy ſhal neuer withdrawne v according alſo ſayth another text prophete abacucke sith ſo let v ſayth pray affliction ſuffer v ſurmiſe hee taketh v enimies may vnderſtād deſerue well haue warre hand find mortall enimie bicauſe wee haue prouoked yet notwithſtanding ceaſſeth father go forward goodneſſe towards v howe much ſoeuer haue deſerued contrarie herewithall although wee bee tempted maner thinke god taketh v enimies yet let v ceaſſe fight ſtill agaynſt ſaying beholde ſure looke vpon mine owne ſtate may well ſeeme god holdeth mee enimy hee hath razed number ſeruants thinke vpon ſuccour mee yet ſo much honour reſt vppon haue none recourſe hym thus ye ſee howe haue withſtande temptation wherewith iob ſore layd albeeit vtterly ouercome nowe addeth immediately annie god come handes incamped round houſe hee termeth aduerſities indured name god armie ſouldiers ſimilitude namely aduerſities whereto bee ſubiect god ſcourges dart errowes ſwords bee ſhort men warre haue v chace hathe bin ſeene heeretofore another ſentence right neceſſarie knowne although wee confeſſe generall ſpeech yet ſo fully perſuaded requiſite ſurely men ſuffer aduerſitie cannot withholde themſelues thinking happened ſome misfortune fall hayle come froſt feare vine marre corne ſtraightwayes euill fortune maner ſpeech proceedeth wee looke euer neereſt hand mount higher knowe thinges god diſpoſing ſay cauſe men runne continually intoo groſſe blockiſhneſſe ſo scripture ſpeaketh affliction telling v god holdeth hande bee men warre bee ſouldyers bee ſerue turne hee ſendeth hee diſpoſeth good pleaſure let v marke well euery whit end whenſoeuer turne commeth bee afflicted maner wiſe may alwayes looke vp god hand aſſure ſelues ſame ſtriketh v thereby let v learne humble ourſelues ſaying well lorde ſee men trouble ſee theſe lower cauſes ſee wherefore ſuch thing befalne meane lord thou art aboue therefore behoueth looke vp vnto thee acknowledge ſtrokes come thine hand furthermore let v marke alſo god hath onely one armie one ſworde one cudgell ſmite v with▪ hath bandes hath whole hoſtes readie beſiege v ſides iob ſpeaketh heere therefore whenſoeuer bee ſcaped one miſerie god well plucke v backe againe poynt verie profitable although men bee conuinced god hande perſecuteth yet conceyue alwayes ſome vaine hope get thinke thus vvell diſpatch well ynough yet ſuch ſhift beholde pray whereas men ought humble themſelues vnder hande god become ſtubborne agaynſt beare themſelues hand daſhe horne ſhall driue great way ſpecially ſee ſtubbornneſſe v god ſmiteth v rodde bee puffed vp pryde preſumption thinke hee doth v great wrong conſidering hee might pinche v hundred folde thus ye ſee haue marke finally iob complayneth freends againſt euen poynt hee declareth hee knew god hande ſentence dooth yet better confirme haue ſayde alreadie ende might knowe farre leſſon extendeth diſeaſes god men warre yea alſo ſcourges ſwordes ſcripture vſeth theſe ſimilitudes intent according rudeneſſe wee mighte better conceyue thinges otherwyſe could well enter head yet notwithſtanding ſomewhat agree capacitie men chaunge vpon ſodaine become aduerſaries ought bee freendes acquaintance increaſe miſerie ſeemeth commeth god verie deede whereof come ſuch conceyts men owne corruption neuertheleſſe god ſmiteth v ſtill prouidence guideth alſo long wee looke vpon thing wee would neuer haue thought men ſhoulde haue chaunged ſort haue vſed ſuch ſpyte therefore conclude ſuche chaunges come god true deede faultie done amiſſe tolde v god ſeemeth v euill faultineſſe god behoueth v conſider howe doctrine bee vnderſtood certaine men bee malicious cruell towardes v naughtineſſe themſelues yet therefore ſaid god leadeth therevntoo bereeuing good kindly affection willing haue v perſecuted yet notwithſtanding god ſo doth euill hee hath good iuſt cauſes doth thing vprightly men cannot ſay euill hath bin intent obey owne conſciences commaundementes doo ſufficiently conuince contrarie vvee ſee iob hath caces reſpectes graunted ſuche power vnto god hee may doo hee creature ſerue owne turne puniſh v thinkes good ſend v ſickneſſe well come hee ſende v calamity ſo wee bee deſtitute good thing god doth iob hath ſaide afore although theeues taken away goodes yet ſayth lorde hath giuen lorde hath taken away bliſſed name lorde let v wey well iob ſheweth heere witte freends againſt came ſting yea imbattailed agaynſt minding fully tread vnder foote knewe howe god ſo hardned hart willing ſhould vſe courteſie towards iob therefore imputed vnto god ſhoulde ſay lorde thou perſecuteſt mee ſuch exceſsiue rate wote ſay thou haſt ſet butte ſhoote al thy vengeance vvhere seemeth thou haſt ſent hell lo wherevnto iobs tale tendeth true good diſcretiō knowing howe god withdrawne freendes yet infirmitie ſheweth ſelfe quieted himſelfe hee ſawe temptation ought haue ſayd vvell lorde true thou haſt armed men againſt thou haſt ſent bid battell yet wayt ſuccour thy hand ſeeing pleaſeth thee ſerue thy turne men ſcourging retire vnto thee aſſuring ſelfe thou canſt well chaunge heart ſhall pleaſe thee lo poynt iob ought haue come came firſt blow yet went forward vnto therefore let v looke ſelues whenſoeuer men practize deſtruction perſecute v may ſtay ſticke wee muſt know haue god therefore let v runne vnto may truſt goodneſſe chaſtized creature let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying hym graunt v grace profite ſuch wiſe affliction chaſticements ſendeth v wee may bee humbled meekned come aduance ſelues check againſt ſtrengthened power may ſtand ſtedfaſtly obeying yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe ſigh grone ſeeing daunger wherein vntill reache hande v aboue thing wee may looke vp lorde ieſus chriſt aſſuring ſelues made like affliction wee ſhall haue wherewith reioyce ſorrowes wayting day fulneſſe ioy hee ſhall gather v glorie reſurrection whereinto gone afore may pleaſe graunt grace onely v lxxj sermon third vpon xix chapter 17 breath lothſome vvife though intreate hir childrens ſake mine ovvne bodie 18 euen little one ſhunne vvhen riſe vp caſt ſcoffes agaynſt 19 freends haue abhorred vvhom loued turned agaynſt 20 bone cleaueth skinne fleſh ſcaped vvith skinne teeth 21 haue pitie vpon haue pitie vpon freends hand god hath ſmitten mee 22 vvhy perſecute god doth ſatisfied vvith fleſh 23 vvordes vvere vvritten vvere regiſtred booke 24 vvith penne ofyron leade ſtone euer 25 ſure redeemer liueth ſhall laſt riſe vp vpon earth foraſmuche god hath knitte men togyther ende one ſhoulde beare vppe another eche manne indeuoure helpe neighboure wee doo wee ſhoulde haue pitie compaſsion one another wee happen bee deſtitute helpe ſo wee bee troubled ſydes man ſheweth v anye kindneſſe euerie man cruell v temptation verie ſore cauſe iob complayneth ſentence neyther wyfe freend houſeholde pitied worlde forſaken nowe wee heare theſe thing wee muſte applie ſelues declared yeſterday god ſuffereth men fayle v euery bodie ſhrinke v ende might better reſort vnto indeede ſo long wee haue ſtay worlde wee truſt god wee ought doo rather wee hilde heere bylowe nature inclyneth much much giuen thitherwarde therefore god intending nowe plucke v backe himſelfe maketh v vtterly deſtitute worldly helpe elſe hee doth humble v ſeemeth v hee ought reaſon haue regarde v wee bee woorthie euerie v blyndeth himſelfe ſuch preſumption lord therefore mindeth teach v ſome lowlineſſe meane euerie man deſpiſeth v become outcaſtes great ſmall ſo wee haue conſider wee ſame haue taken ſelues whatſoeuer come paſſe let v ſure god hath therefore forſaken v ſee iob hath recourſe ſtill vntoo diſappoynted hope god reached hande notwithſtanding men ſhaken imagined bee paſt hope recouerie god eye ſhewe mercie therefore let v truſt beſides let v learne duetie towardes ſuche afflicted according haue tolde god hath knitte vnited v togither ende ſhould haue communitie one another men muſt ſeparate themſelues vtterly aſunder true lorde hath ordeyned common pollicie euerie man ſhoulde haue houſe meynie wyfe child euery man knowne degree yet muſte man exempt himſelfe communitie ſay liue alone liue worſe brute beaſt vvhat let v aſſure ſelues god hath bound v one another ende ſhould helpe one another ſee man neceſsitie although wee cannot doo ſo much good wee would yet leaſtwiſe wee muſt pitifull towards bee v let v marke perſon iob holy ghoſt asketh vngeance againſt v dout although iob toſſed hideous exceſsiue paſsions yet alwayes gouerned god ſpirit ſpecially reſpect theſe generall ground ſay reſpect ſentences hee ſetteth downe according haue tolde import right profitable doctrine vvherefore let v mark lord telleth v ouergreat crueltie v ſee poore man afflicted indeuour ſuccour rather ſhrinke away alſo let v marke ſometimes ſame ſayde euen thing holy ſcripture occaſion whereby may gather good leſſon ſayde iob owne wife ſaith ſhe able abide breath though prayed hir childrens ſake hir owne wombe hee ſheweth child ought bee increaſement loue betweene man wife god bliſſeth mariage iſſue ought increaſe mutuall affection liue greater concorde verie paynim knewe well ynough ill perfourmed thoſe ought ſee much cleerer cōdemnation ſhall bee beleeuers boaſt themſelues haue bin inſtructed woorde god knowe nature ſheweth ſillie ignorant ſort good blinde looke vpon painims haue acknowledged child gage confirme better loue man wife holde peace vnitie according herevnto iob ſayth hee intreated wife childrens ſake begot hir moued hir al thē ſheweth thing againſt nature behalfe wife ſhewed hirſelfe bee worſe wilde beaſt let v marke ſuch cannot follow order heere rebuked way holye ghoſt pronounced condemnation expreſſe termes yet notwithſtanding ſee many men haue diſcretion god ſo gracious giue child looke vpon maried man true mariage alreadie ſelfe ſo holy thing onely ſaying ought ſuffiſe ſaide ſhall bee two one fleſh man ſhall make account vnitie hee ought haue wife vnitie whiche hee hathe father mother god yet confirmation ſayde grace addeth increaſe child mariage men woman ſo beaſtly prouoked led thereby loue one another better certainly vnkindneſſe tooto groſſe howbeit haue ſayde alreadie thing euill practiſed among chriſtians neuertheleſſe behoueth v take profite ſaying though touched heere occaſion increaſe euill iob ſayth freends alſo men counſell ſay thoſe whome hee woont communicate hys ſecretes turned themſelues againſt elſe ſcorned ſo made none account ſome credite authoritie alſo euen meanest ſort verie raſcals deſpiſed effect meening hee founde himſelfe deſtitute help ſeeing friend fayled ſecōdly bin ſcorningſtocke inſomuche euen baſeſt ſort world vouchſafed looke vpon take one retinew muſt needes bee ſayde affliction great ſeeing none would acknowledge companie men tooke alreadie outcaſt lo effect iob ment ſay haue touched alreadie god wil exerciſing ſo make myrrour vnto v happen thoſe neereſt v become deadly enimies perſecute v let v learne flee vnto god beare paciently ſeeing happened ſo vntoo iob v ſpecially foraſmuch ſame perteyneth member church let v beare minde ſaying lord ieſus chriſt eateth bread table hathe lyfted vp heele agaynſt mee muſt needes fulfilled faithfull therfore hath lord ieſus ſhewed v way intent wee ſhould bee loth become comformable image vve ſee continually faythfull ſhall bee betrayed perſecuted ſuch truſt moſt priuieſt wyth dooings verie well right hard cace cannot bee denyed wee feele miſcheefe ynough diſcourage v howbeeit foraſmuch lorde hath tolde v muſt ſo hath giuen v record ſonne let v paſſe ſame way ſubmit ſelues ſame condition thus yee ſee againe wee haue marke text let v come iob addeth haue pitie vpon haue pitie vppon mee freendes hande lorde hath touched mee alreadie true wee ſee god puniſh men ought dutie glorifie ſaying lorde thou art rightuous howbeeit ſpeciall conſideration iob howe puniſhment faulte hee committed ſome ende againe put cace bin chaſtized deſerts yet notwithſtanding wee ſee poore offender whome god hath put execution muſt bee touched ſelues two cauſes one euerie v looke himſelfe wee ſhall finde god ought puniſhe v roughly roughlyer pleaſed viſite v according deſertes therefore whoſoeuer bethinks himſelfe well ſhall finde himſelfe woorthie bee puniſhed greeuouſly thoſe hee ſeeth ſore diſtreſſed therefore wee ought looke vpon pitie compaſsion ſo muſte oure vyces ſinnes cauſe v humble ſelues beholde poore wretch ſee god perſecuteth terrible thing good cauſe god ſhoulde puniſh likewiſe behoueth mee humble myſelfe behold myſelfe glaſſe perſon man one poynt againe ſee man ſcourged god hande ſore may bee let v conſider created image god alſo hee neighbour manner one v vve bee one nature one fleſh one mankinde ſo may ſayde bee iſſued one ſelfe ſame ſpring sith ſo ought wee haue conſideration one another ſee moreouer poore ſoule going deſtruction ought pitie helpe lie power although able yet ought ſorie ſay two reaſons ought moue v pitie wee ſee god afflicteth ſuch woorthie wee bethinke ſelues ſurely either muſt needes bee hardharted dulwitted elſe ſhall pitie like ſelues wee conſider beholde man formed image god hee ſelfe ſame nature againe beholde ſoule purchaſed bloud ſonne god ſame periſh ought bee greeued cauſe iob ſayth haue pitie vpon mee freendes bycauſe bande god hath ſmitten mee better vnderſtanding heereof muſt take grounde dreadfull thing fall intoo handes liuing god therefore ſee god ſende puniſhment behoueth v bee moued feare yea euen although ſpare v ſelf reſt god maketh countenance touche ſee ſmiteth one puniſheth another matter bee aſtoniſhed muſt tarie till god fall vpon heades many blowes ouer groſſe dealing ſee minded teach v another man coſt behoueth v haue eye cauſe hee puniſheth men ſo according saint paule telleth v hee ſayth afrayd wrath god ſhall come vppon hee ſayeth freendes yee ſee howe god puniſheth vnbeleeuers ſpareth yet muſt vnderſtande inſtruction hee ſhe weth token hys wrath vpon men let v marke well ſentence apoſtle dreadfull thing fall handes liuing god therefore oft puniſhment let v moued thereby wee ſhall hand taught pitie ſuch diſtreſſe ſay ala poore creature ſome mortall wight afflicted man might giue ſome releefe god agaynſt ought wee ſorie wee ſee man alledge reſiſting god wee ſhould ſorie thoſe puniſhed fault much ſtriue againſt god iuſtice may well haue ſuch affection v allow god iuſtice yeelding prayſe glorie doth yet neuertheleſſe bee ſorie puniſhed bycauſe ſelues maye haue deſerued muche ought ſeeke welfare men ſpeecially thoſe neereſt v god hath put bande betwixt v according wee may allowe ciuill iuſtice whiche nothing elſe little glaſſe god iuſtice yet ceaſſe haue pitie vpon offender vvhen tranſgreſſer puniſhed men ſay hee hath wrong done vnto crueltie iudge ſay ſuch ſet place iuſtice diſcharge duetie offer acceptable ſacrifice vnto god put offender death yet meane wee ceaſſe pitie poore creature ſhall ſuffer euill doings moued thereat manhood v graunt worldly iuſtice little ſparke god iuſtice pray wee come ſoueraine ſeate iuſtice high ought wee firſt glorifie god doth aſſuring ſelues hee iuſt vpright poynts reſpects yet notwithſtanding ſayd afore ſame ſhall hinder v pitie ſuch ſuffer puniſhment comfort ſuccoure wee good wiſh ſaluation praying god make correction profitable drawing home ſuffer become hardharted ſtriue againſt hand behold ſay wherevnto iob groundeth ſelf deſireth beſeecheth frinds haue pitie vpon ſpeaketh purpoſely thoſe next although god haue generally ſet vnitie among men ſay although hee hath knitte altogither haue ſayde afore ought ſeparate ſelues one another yet notwithſtanding hee byndeth v dubble eyther kinred aliance betwixt v • know neighbour ought moued yeeld priuate freendſhip one another behalfe god hath ye would ſay put v vnder one yoke men might put beaſts brute beaſts ought teach v haue vvhen two ox yoked togither bee ſtubborne trouble one another agree laboure willingly togither alſo drinke togither ſleepe togither muſt needes tormentor cace euen ſo men vvhen god matcheth togither manner ſoeuer woulde cupple vnder one yoke ayde ſupport nowe ſturdie worſe brute beaſts condemnation bring vpon owne head let v marke well god linketh v togither giueth v meane communicate togither ſo doth bind v one another friend bound freend man although behoue oure charitie bee generall v loue thoſe whome god commendeth vnto v yea though mortall enimies yet ſhall husband bounde wife father child child father kinsfolke alſo one another behoueth v knowe generally degree frendſhip god hath ſet world iob addeth vvhy doo perſecute god doth ſhould ſeeme ſaying hath great reaſon haue touched alreadie ſayd rightuous man ſhall waſh handes bloud vngodly ought bee glad ſee god puniſh wicked iob alledgeth heere men ought perſecute thoſe whome god afflicteth queſtion hath bin diſſolued already ſayde wee may well agree god iuſtice yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe pitie comfort thoſe ſuffer lie v leaſtwiſe wee muſt haue affection wiſhe ſaluation cruell matter ſhoulde perſecute men well god doth god puniſheth ſinners meane rightuous ſort ſuche iob ſuch haue liued amiſſe led wicked life ende ſhould looke bigge vpon vexe firſt euerie v ſhould learne condemne himſelfe another man perſon ſay ſee man ſmitten god roddes ſinnes god iudge whole world yes doth matter concerne alſo giltleſſe nothing god may finde fault ala nothing ſinfulneſſe mee yea groſſe ſinfulneſſe ye ſee mē ought condemne themſelues folkes perſones oft wee ſee god ſendeth puniſhmentes vpon therewithall alſo god myndeth inure v pitifulneſſe compaſsion follow order wee amiſſe wee fall greeuing thoſe haue much greefe alreadie without hauing reſpect fault crueltie would vſurpe god office iudges whereas ought rather bethinke v howe ſayde v muſt appeere iudgement ſeate god true haue ſayde god ought right bee glorified puniſhments ſendeth vpon men much ſay bicauſe know god muſt iudge men therefore man ought condemne ſelfe holde himſelfe within compaſſe ſome humanitie thus ye ſee iob hath iuſt cauſe reproue frends perſecuting god let v marke wel god vtter vengeance vpō ſuch haue offēded meening arme v vnnaturalneſſe ſet v rage againſt pore paciēts vtterly caſt downe rather wold ſhould rue againe iob blameth crueltie friend ſaying cannot ſatiſfied fleſh vvherefore ſayth hee ye ſatisfie ſelues fleſhe certaine thing whiche hee taketh ſimilitude ye would ſay ſo fleſht vpon neighbour one would eate aliue wee alſo often vſe ſuche manner ſpeeches common talke like man taketh pleaſure repaſt eating drinking ſo ſeemeth cruell againſt neighbour could find hart feede vpon eate vp ſwallow quicke ye ſee iob ſayth vvhy ye ſatisfie ſelues fleſh wee ſee oure neighbour haue aduerſitie ynoughe ynough yet ſatiſfied increaſe miſeries great crueltie one would eate vp therefore circumſtance bee noted well iob ſayth leaſtwiſe freendes ought haue beene ſatisfied ſee ſo ouerthrowne vvhat would ye ſayth laſt caſt ſo holde longer wee haue hated man wiſhed harme ſought meanes bee reuenged yet hee happen fall extreme miſerie beholde naturall thing anger bee appeaſed yet ſay ſuch affection ought counted vertue although heathen men wicked thought lawfull reuenge yet notwithſtanding mynde would appeaſed ſaw enimies ſo ſore afflicted needed put theyr hand admit man haue done ſome man harme vvel offended would reuenge himſelfe poſsible nowe meane god preuenteth ſendeth ſome great miſfortune vppon offender man ere full rancor deſired nothing deſtroy whome hee hated ſay yea ſhall hee ſo oppreſſed pitie ſee hee hath ynough already thus fyre dooth naturally quenche ſelfe ſee man aduerſitie though wee neuer ſo much moued againſt ſaid vertue neither deſerueth counted god ſeruice charitie yet ſuch naturall inclination euen among painims ſhal become thoſe whiche adayes ſatiſfied ſee enimies perſecuted extremitie ſo vnſatiable could find hart euen eate vp damnable done man enimies ſo contented miſeries god ſendeth vpon thing done man friend therefore let ſuch ſo cruell aſſure themſelues worthie counted number men whoſoeuer mindeth diſcharge himſelfe duetie muſte onely appeaſe himſelf miſerie affliction enimies muſt alſo moued pitie ſtead ſeking reuenge muſt rather bee readie ſuccour much hee doubt god ſendeth aduerſitie enimies vntoo ſuch haue offended v intent aſſuage malice rancour v ſhift away cauſe made v bee ſo yll minded towardes oure neighbour nowe god call v gentleneſſe wee go cleane manifeſt fighting agaynſt let v marke well god ſcourge haue done v anye wrong iniurie aſſuage bitterneſſe oure ſtomackes haue beene angrie diſpleaſed haue coueted reuengement god intendeth meeken thoſe lewde affection v lead v compaſsion kindneſſe lo haue marke ſtreyne nowe iob addeth newe complaint miſeries ſaying bone cleaued skinne hee eſcaped skinne betwixt teeth ſerueth expreſſe matter better come touch witte friend ought right haue bin ſatiſfied though beene verie beaſts ſought deuour ſayth ye ſee ſtate vvhat deſire ye man wiſh miſerie one perſon god hath ſent vpon ſayth skinne claue bone much hee ſayde hee vtterly withered away hee become right image deade man moyſture ſubſtance hee ſayeth ſcaped skinne teeth v vnderſtand whole part gummes hys skinne become lyke gummes woorme breede man bodie skinne bee drie wil like skinne gummes ſay rottenneſſe hath gotten vpper hande woormeaten man ſhall ſee fleſhe bloudie ooze halfe bloud half water wound like ſee howe wound reſemble skinne man gummes thus iob declareth ſo diſfigured phiſnomie man coulde diſcerned ſeeing come ſuch extremitie beene reaſon freends ſhould haue bin contented warned looke better vpon neighbour aduerſities haue done god ſendeth miſeries pray giue v grace haue eye better open conſider marke well ſo ſame may moue v pitie euerie v indeuer remedie much finally hope god hath ſo layde hand vpon wil ſhewe himſelfe mercifull towardes forſomuch iobs friendes accuſed blaſphemie agaynſt god iuſtifying himſelfe withoute cauſe blinding himſelfe owne vice want acknowledging ſayth wordes written ingraued penne yron ingraued lead ſtone euer endleſſe memoriall ſaying ſo iob declareth mainteyned innocencie vaine neither feared bee blamed god knewe hee iuſt cauſe ſo thus ye ſee effect whereat ameth neuertheleſſe certaine reſpect iobs wordes exceſſe much bytalke hee kept meaſure howe good reaſonable ground ſoeuer hee cace allowable god yet miſconuey haue declared heeretofore many woordes eſcaped blamewoorthie vvhy ſayth hee ſtill woulde faine hys wordes written ynough bring double condemnation vpon owne heade let v marke iob hathe eye principall poynt tyeth himſelfe euerie worde vttered taketh ſayings heere defence cace nowe defence iuſt although miſſehandled often lept nowe one ſide yet notwithſtanding hee ſtill mainteyned rightly hee puniſhed ſinnes bee counted wickeddeſt man worlde bycauſe god ſhewed himſelfe ſo rigorous iob hath ſet downe thing vpon good reaſon yet hath done amiſſe hee acknowledged ſinnes ſuche wiſe hee might feele himſelfe alwayes faultie god heereby wee bee warned bee verie well aduiſed wee ſay ſayde pſalme determined ſelfe holde peace brydle ſelfe ſo long wicked bare ſway full ſcope ende coulde refrayne dauid knewe well god child tempted ſeeing themſelues oppreſſed affliction wicked ſorte tryumph haue winde weather ſo ſore cace hardly refraine ſelues murmuring agaynſt god cauſe ſayde determined brydle ſelfe put ſnaffle coped vp lippes intent might ſpeake worde end theſe let broken determination purpoſed vpon could holde mee vttering deſire conceyued wythin finally fyre kindled brake hereby dauid ſheweth verie great rare vertue bee pacient ſilence holde tongue miſeries oppreſſe v ſpecially wee ſee wicked men mouthes open boaſt themſelues ſcoffe v ioyning ſaying dauids example iob wee muſt learne keepe mouth ſhut god afflicteth v affection ſo headie although haue learned ſpeake ſimply prayſe bliſſe god wee ought yet ſo well aduiſed ſo well ſtayed ſomething eſcape v ſome bubble burſt ſo wee ſhall alwayes bee faultie talke although wee haue intent blaſpheme god ſpeake thing may bee honour yet auoyded wee ſhall bee ouerhardie talke like iob deſyred haue ſayings regiſtred ingraued euerlaſting rememberance printed ſtone leade intent might neuer blotted let v rather aduiſe ſelues pray god forgiue v faultes wee make euen thoſe wordes thinke bee pureſt ſayth sant iames refraine tongue hath ſingular vertue ſwift ſpeake euill wee thinke wee haue ſpoken verie ſoundly god ſtill find ſomewhat amiſſe thus ye ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne ende iob addeth knoweth redeemer liueth verely cannot wholly expounded nowe yet muſt touch intent whiche iob ſayd ſo meening delt maner hypocrite ſmoothing cace men iuſtifie himſelfe knewe hee doo god thing wee ought knowe theſe ſentences heere ſhoulde bee taken broken matter woulde haue great edifying neyther ſhoulde wee knowe iob ment vvherefore let v remember haue touched afore vvhat iob pretendeth vvee knowe men labour excuſe themſelues bycauſe thinke vppon god ynoughe worlde lykes well bee taken honeſt men thus dooth hypocriſie ingender vnſhamefaſtneſſe knowe god bee iudge ſuffice mee menne clappe handes mee haue mee good reputation gayne nothing exceeding great ſhameleſneſſe although mine owne conſcience accuſe mee bee conuicted haue done amiſſe yet perke vp nebbe ſay whereof man accuſe vvhat haue done haue good cace take fayre colour couer skinne bleare men eye tuſhe cace ſhall ſpeede well ynough ſpake namely hipocriſie ingendreth ſhameleſneſſe ſo men become bolde mainteyne cace good bycauſe haue regard god iob contrariwiſe ſaith know god aliue ende • ee riſe vp vpon dust hee ſhoulde ſay taken wicked man deſperate perſone though blaſphemed god labouring iuſtifie ſelfe agaynſt deſire nothing humble ſelfe vnto repoſe ſelfe wholly grace yet muſt faine mainteyne mine vprightneſſe agaynſt ſee go woorke nothing ſlaunders defence ſuche ſort meane looke vntoo god haue mine eye faſtned vppon heereof wee may ought gather good leſſon muſt bee ſo popeholie couer faultes afore men make countenance mainteyning good cace beare face honeſt men yet bee reproued owne conſcience rather let v learne enter ſelues examine owne ſinnes cite ſelues god let v ſay beginne poynt ſay howe intend true may well excuſe ſelfe afore men meane time ſhall boote god vvill accept therefore according let v come heauenly iudge great ſmall let euerie one v preſent himſelfe craue pardon offence let v doubt come vnfeynedly acquit v worthineſſe owne owne grace mercie nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele right caſt downe ought bee may repayre ſoueraine refuge infinite goodneſſe whiche hee hath promiſed v lorde ieſus chriſt take ſo ſure foundation may doubt fauour towardes v yea although wee doo alwayes feele ſame ſort worlde outwarde woorking rather hee ſheweth v ſome token rigoure yet may ceaſſe call vpon aduerſities doubting ende ſhewe ſelfe louing mercifull father towardes v make v feele proofe alſo tyme conuenient may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo al people c lxxij sermon fourth vpon xix chapter sermon conteyneth ſtill expoſition fiue twentith verſe text following 26 although skinne vvoormes deſtroy bodie yet ſhall ſee god fleſh 27 ſhall beholde mine eye ſhall ſee none kidneyes vvaſted boſome 28 haue ſayde vvherein perſecuted roote matter found 29 ye afrayde preſence ſvvorde vvrath affliction vvith ſvvorde intent ye ſhould knovv iudgement yeſterday ſaw proteſtation iob made hee eye vpon god tyed men bycauſe whiche reſt themſelues low willing enter owne conſciences condemne themſelues ought feele owne ſinnes might confeſſe themſelues haue done amiſſe craue forgiueneſſe god hand ſee aſſoone bee fleſht among men deſire ouercome bee truth vntruth lo heere cauſe thinke rightly vpon god conſequently indeuer mend miſdoings ought ſhort nothing hypocriſie therefore iob ſayeth hee knoweth redeemer aliue ſhoulde ſay pleading hitherto bin iuſtifie himſelfe ſuch wiſe afore men though marke ſhot knewe ſhoulde bee faine come god iudged render account hys life afterwarde addeth god ſhall ſtande vp fast vpon dust ſayde vvhen men faile worlde muſt needes periſh yet doth god continue euer therefore great follie mee deſire excuſe ſelfe afore men meane god ſhoulde condemne iudges nowe whether willing bee ſo whether caſt honour vpon muſt periſh mee god muſt continue euer ſuffizeth mee yeeld ſelfe vntoo heare ſhall pleaſe determine whereas ſayth god ſhall ſtande vp vpon duſt meeneth like men ſeeing muſt v fade away euen till wee come nothing wee knowe wee muſt returne whence came euen intoo corruption rottenneſſe god ſayth hee neuer decay men hee continue ſtate euerlaſtingly againe let v marke iob meant doo v vnderſtande god wyll ſpred ſame power vppon duſt ſay vpon men nothing ne haue power ſtrength title hee yeeldeth vnto god importeth yet namely maker partie mainteyned god liſted coulde continue full ſtate meane ſhould periſh intendeth make v partaker ſtrength cauſe v feele ſo hee ſtandeth vp ſuch ſort vpon duſt hee maketh duſt awake hand ſetteth vp againe ſo vaine named redeemer maker therefore let v marke well iob intended declare god holdeth ſayde power incloſed onely owne beeing alſo ſpreadeth vpon men good leſſon v firſt warned fondneſſe deſirous pleaſe men allowed men vvhat gain euery whit muſt fall ground therefore let v learne haue eye faſtened vpon god may like v allow v marke whervnto muſt applie indeuer heerewithall intent hilde backe world wrapped hypocriſie ouer ſurely rooted v nature lette v aſſure ſelues god warrant belongeth mainteyne men ſoundneſſe ſhal haue walked pure conſcience ſhall one day iudge ſtand vp vpon duſt albeeit thing whiche wee ſee aboute v bee frayle tranſitorie yet god like hath higher ſtate onely himſelfe alſo ſet creature ſtate bee diſordered ineſtimable comforte godly ſee themſelues borne downe ſlaunders worlde although haue indeuered walke aright yet men ceaſſe heaue backebite falſely ſtill referre themſelues god call witneſſe reſt vpon aſſurance ſtande men ſhall brought • nothing vvell preſume condemne v rayle vpon v muſt tumble downe chaunce muſt bee quite turned god length bee oure redeemer nowe raſhneſſe men vſurpe god power vndertake lawfull ende god muſt ſhewe himſelfe hee muſt bee exalted may knowe howe belongeth mainteyne v beholde wee ought call minde oft men doo falſely miſrepor • v wee haue good recorde god namely ynough v vphilde alloweth v though worlde beſide reiect v nowe let v come iob ſayeth hee ſayeth vvoormes although woorde woormes bee ſet downe hebrewe text yet well ſeene hee meeneth vermine corruption hauing eaten skinne alſo gnawe fret away reſt yet ſayeth hee truſteth ſee god yea ſee fleſhe ſay beeing reſtored againe yea ſayth ſhall ſee none notwithſtanding kidneyes bee conſumed ſay ſtrength bee weakened taken away proteſtation woorthie bee noted iob ſayeth hee haue looke faſtened vpon god none yea euen though vtterly conſumed▪ ſhoulde ſay would meaſure hope god might ſee euen nothing appeereth yet therefore ceaſſe looke vntoo god howe man finde himſelfe forſaken god ſo perceyue nothing matter deſpayre death manace ſydes yea readie ſwallow vp yet neuertheleſſe holdes ſtill ſtedfaſt fayth ſay yet call vpon god ſhall yet feele helpe mightineſſe ynough ſelfe giue v courage yea ſhall bee euen ſhall ſeeme bee forlorne man ouerpaſſeth worldly thing ſhewing fayth hope whiche hee hath god thing may bee ſeene comprehended naturall reaſon paſſeth worlde according ſayde wee muſt hope beyonde hope hope thing hidden nowe wee ſee iobs meening true hee ſpeaketh expreſſely reſurrection yet theſe woordes cannot bee expounded muſt bee peceyued iob ment attribute ſuch power vnto god ſeene common order nature therefore one ſayd god wil haue v know onely doth v good preſerueth nurriſheth v alſo although faile v ſeeming ſee nothing death v yet muſte fully reſolued lorde leaue bee keeper ſhall bee maynteyned protection howbeit better profite ourſelues ſentence lette v wey throughly iob ſayeth although remnant ſayeth bee eaten away vnder skin yet ſhall ſee god beleeue god bycauſe maketh earth bring foorth corne wine ſee number brutiſh folke haue none taſt feeling god heauen hee feedeth filleth belly man aske whiche god anſwere nurriſheth v true ought conceyue goodneſſe power god benefites hee beſtoweth vpon v yet muſt ſtay ſayde wee muſte mount fayth aboue thing bee ſeene world therfore lette v ſay beleeue god bycauſe maynteyneth bicauſe gyueth health bicauſe nurriſheth beleue god bicauſe hath giuen heeretofore ſome taſt goodneſſe power hauing care body whiche rottenneſſe ſo ſee hee ſheweth himſelfe father haue power ſpirite beleeue alone bicauſe calleth heauen hath created oxe aſſe liue heere little whyle hath formed owne image intent ſhoulde hope inheritance kingdome bee parttaker glory sonne beleeue hee allureth dayly thither intente ſhould doubt body layde graue conſumed nothing yet notwithſtanding ſhal reſtored agayne laſtday meane ſoule ſhall ſafe ſure keeping bycauſe dead god haue protection ſhall behold much better life lorde ieſus chriſte▪ hath purchaced v bloud thus ye ſee beleefe muſt well ruled ſo well diſpoſed wee may ſay iob well verely ſee body muſt go decay looke freſhneſſe ſoeuer diminiſheth day day neede go farre ſeeke death ſee ſo ſmall infirmitie fleſhe ſame meſſenger death yet al ſhall ſee god wee could ſpeake ſo wee ſee ſtrength droupeth vaniſheth away little little although pleaſed god ſmite v ſuch wiſe wee ſhould maner rotte aboue grounde iob ſayeth skinne wormeaten conſumed good dead yet proteſteth hee wyll ceaſſe looking vntoo god yet ſhould wee ceaſſe truſt god ſtill example iob thus ye ſee greatneſſe affliction god ſendeth v ſhall aſtoniſh v ſo wee haue learned know bee ſuch one towardes v indeede▪ ſay conſider well end hee hathe created v ſtill maynteyneth v world furthermore iob ſayeth hee ſhall ſee redeemer fleſh meening ſayd afore hee ſhall reſtored new ſtate though skinne ſo eaten ſayeth expreſly bone ſhall bee conſumed nothing ſhall remayne whole afterwarde hee addeth ſhall ſet god fleſh ſhall ſee fleſh▪ ſay ſhall bee ſet former ſtate ſee god yet agayne ſo confeſſeth god able ynough ſet vp agayne although hee vtterly conſumed plunged bottomleſſe pit thus yee ſee condicion wherevpon wee muſt truſt god hee ſhall haue layde v graues wee ſhould aſſure ſelues reach v hand lift v agayne therfore let v ſay truſt god bycauſe ſee aſsiſteth fayleth thing god fayleth v eſtraunged v let v euen ſay iob ſhall ſee fleſhe nothing ſeeme bee ſhadowe life vaniſheth away hand yet god ſhewe himſelfe mightie behalfe ſo ſhall ſee iob ſpake thus time yet greate learning perchaunce law yet written admit nother yet prophetes leaſtwiſe mo moyſes prophet make mention iob man old time ſay iob hauing little ſparke light ſo ſtrengthened affliction ſaw ſome one kind death alſo god ſeemed haue ſet hym ſpectacle among men dreadfull terrible thing able ſay yet ſhall ſee god excuſe v theſe dayes god ſheweth v reſurrection ſo neerely expreſly giueth v ſo many goodly promiſes ſpecially conſidering ſee mirrour ſubſtance thereof lorde ieſus chriſt whome hath rayzed againe intent put v doubt ſhall one day parttakers ſame immortall glorie ſo muche aſſurance cannot brought ſame beliefe iob muſt needes charged vnthankfulneſſe could imbrace god promiſes true fayth would ſufficient power make v mount ouer temptation ſo reigne ouer v let v marke well text wee may ſay paule cotage body gone termeth cotage thing made leaues ſhed nothing woorth wee haue much better excellenter buylding prepared v heauen outward man ſay pertayneth preſent life ſeene done away yet would god renew v againe yea maketh v alreadie beholde reſurrection ſort ſee body waſte away manner according alſo another texte ſame paule ſendeth v ſeede caſt earth ſaying ſame cannot grow haue liuely roote yeeld good fruite except firſt rotte wee ſee death hath dominion ouer v lette v marke god minded giue v true life ſay heauenly life purchaced v precious bloud sonne leaſt temptation worlde woulde ouercome v haue ſayd already miſeries haue ſuffer many meſſages death wee ſawe death thought ſhuld make cleane riddance v muſt needes vtterly quayle none meane comfort v oure affliction onely doctrine euer v conſumed yet ſhall wee ceaſſe ſee god yea ſee fleſh afterward ſayd mine eye ſhall beholde none iob addeth continuing matter maynteyned wit seing god hath aſſured make mee ſtrong agayne hold wholly vnto him▪ neede ſtray bee haled one way behoueth holde ſelfe alone myne eye ſhall behold none behold heere one goodly leſſon hee ſpake erewhyle wit hee ſhoulde ſee god fleſh hath relation experience god ſhould ſet vp agayne vpon feete ſpeaketh nowe ſpoken another reſpect witte reſpect hope god ſeene v two maners vve ſee hym ſheweth himſelfe father sauiour effect giuing v open proofe experience behold god hath delyuered ſuch ſickneſſe rayſing death ſame recorde hath layde hand vpon ſuccoure thus ſee yea ſee effectually howbeit euē ſicke likelyhood recouerie ceaſſe ſee god ſtill put truſt him▪ agayne wayte paciently ende hee ſhall giue doubt ſtill althoughe hee take world thus ye ſee yet another maner beholding god iob meeneth ſhal ſee god effect ſet againe former ſtate ſecondly addeth hee ceaſſe beholde hym although ouerwhelmed miſeries hee mine eye ſayeth ſhall faſtned vpon looke aſide heere ſee nature fayth namely gather ſelfe ſuch wyſe vnto god wander abrode bee drawne away wee commonly bee pray cauſe wee cannot repoſe ſelues vpon god meete wee ſhould bycauſe wee parte god office power intoo ſo many peeces gobbettes wee leaue little nothing vvee well ynough ſay god whome belongeth mainteyne v yet wee ceaſſe trudge vp downe forewarde backwarde ſeeke meanes lyue gyuen god proceeding hym wee attribute power god meanes themſelues whereby make idolles thus ye ſee cannot looke vpon god pure eye ſettle truſt contentation therefore let v marke well woordes iob vſeth heere eye ſhall behold god none hee ſayde holde fleeting men put ſelfe wholly god ſay thou lord yea thou whome holde lyfe gone hence thou ſhalte reſtore mee agayne thou haſte promiſed lette v make compariſon betweene iob ſelues iob hauing ſuch aſſurance god goodneſſe ſo familiar teaching hundreth parte wee haue doo notwithſtanding ſay hee ſhall beholde god wee bee excuſed wee fleete fro ſpecially ſeeing lorde ieſus chriſte offereth himſelfe vnto v whome dwelleth whole fulneſſe glorie godhead ful power holy ghoſte ſhewed ſuche time hee rayzed dead ſurely wee neede ſtreyne eyeſight looke farre goſpell cleere looking glaſſe wherein ſee hym face face sith ſo haue touched let v beware wee guiltie ſuche vnthankfulneſſe diſdeyne looke vnto hym offereth hymſelfe ſo familiarly vnto v effect whiche wee haue marke ſtreyne iob addeth although kidneyes bee waſted boſome ſay although ſtrength courage bee ſhort following matter hee entred intoo alreadye ſheweth hys looking vnto god bycauſe liued hys eaſe bycauſe god ſente hys harte deſire bycauſe bene preſerued affliction cleane contrariwiſe although ſuch diſtreſſe ſayeth god ſeemeth thunder vpon ſtrength courage yet looke vnto god mine eye holde mee wholly vnto hym knowe ſhall ſee agayne redeemer keeper euen ſhall haue ſo conſumed concluſion ſayeth frendes haue ſayd wherefore perſecuted wherefore perſecute hym roote cace matter founde ſentēce ſomewhat darke bycauſe word may taken two wayes vvherefore hee perſecuted wherefore perſecute take wherefore perſecuted meening iobs freendes marueled god handled ſo roughly therefore cō cluded bee ſayd hee man vtterly forſaken god ye tranſlate perſecute meening come prepenſed malice take trip byte although diuerſitie touching wordes yet dothe meening come one end lette v conſider doctrine haue gather principall yea whole matter iob chargeth hys friend iudged amiſſe affliction euen firſt daſhe fell ſaying ô needes muſt man ſayd wicked doer walked good conſcience hee ſhould bee ſo puniſhed cōtrariwiſe iob ſayeth roote matter found true hebrewe word ſignifieth ſometime thing matter ſomtime word ſpeach ſaying heere iob meeneth good ſure foundation men haue wel ſifted ſhall find cace ſuch men haue falſely ſurmiſed lette v ſee purpoſe geere tendeth profite wee may reape vvhen iob telleth friendes ſayde wherefore perſecuted ſheweth great crueltie men ſeeke men ſinnes ſee one beaten god roddes ſay needes muſt wicked man therefore let v ſift life point muſt begin true hathe bin ſayde large heeretofore correction chaſtizements god ſendeth wee muſte alwayes behold iuſtice vppon men ſinnes muſt condemne ſelues vvee muſt iudge men let ſelues ſlip let v begin ſay lette v begin ſelues thus wee ſee vſe doctrine man preſſed aduerſitie muſt haſtie condemne ſpecially wee muſt wrinch aſide ſpie faultes rather muſt looke vnto god ſheweth himſelfe bee iudge v cōpelleth v knowe behoueth v haue pitie compaſsion vppon ſuffereth muſt go aduenture although know faultie rather aduiſe ourſelues bring ſome medicine heale let v beware ſet cart horſes ſay wee iudge know cace commonly wont hath bin already oftentimes ſayd god afflicting men alwayes one ſelf ſame end ſometimes puniſheth ſinnes ſometimes triall paciēce elſe ſome reſpect therefore let v ouerhaſtie raſhe iudge wee knowe cace throughly wee ſee happened iobs friend bicauſe ſee afflicted therefore firſt daſh muſt needes wicked man ſay happie mā iudgeth diſcretely afflicted ſayd pſalme vvas dauid pinched ſmartly god hand euer man yet notwithſtanding god ſayeth haue found dauid ſeruant mine owne hart haue anoynted oyle gladneſſe thus doth god holde dauid lappe yet ſee handled bee raſh iudging ſhall condemne dauid abraham holy patriarkes doth ſuch maner iudging redounde diſhonoring god yes ſurely let v ſober modeſt ſee neighbour afflicted let v acknowledge hand god leaſt happen vnto v vnto iobs friend ſayeth preciſely roote cace roote matte • effect ſubſtance heereby hee meeneth men muſt trie iudge good ſoothe euery man graunt ſhould ſtep aduenture fooliſhe preſumption ouerweening v common prouerbe among v ſay fooles bolte ſoone ſhot yet ceaſſe hazard ſelues ſtill without ſearching examining cace ſtandeth vvherfore let v marke well muſt firſt go roote ſitte downe giue iudgement let v iudge ſwiftly feare leaſt might ſeeme ignorant certeſſe thing inforceth men ſwift aſhamed leaſt ſhould ſeeme ſharpwitted ynough iudge firſt ſight blab prittleprattle men wil make none account god laugheth ſuch vayne gloriouſneſſe therfore let v keepe ſelues ſoberneſſe modeſtie vntill god haue ſhewed v wherefore hee puniſheth one man another let v runne true ſhall haue ſearched matter throughly ſhall haue come roote wee may iudge freely iudgement ſhal come ſelues ſhal fetched god bycauſe groū ded vpon word gouerned holy ſpirit howbeit thing behoueth v go roote whereof mention made heere afterward iob ſayeth ye afrayd preſence ſword wrath iniquitie affliction ſword hande ende yee ſhould know iudgement preſent ſaying ſomwhat darke ynough bicauſe word cut effect iobs intent ſaying yee afrayde ſword one ſayd ye ſpeake heere ſhadowe yee diſcourſe pleaſure haue nothing owne leyſure folkes may diſpute like none make better battelles furtheſt blowes giue onſet beſiege townes flea forray ſacke city ſo woonder ſee haue well diſcourſed come marching forewarde indeede doo ſooner heare ſounde drum courage quite quayled iob therefore blameth friend reaſoning ſo cace leyſure telleth thē muſt take holde god iuſtice bee afrayde ſwoorde hee ſhewed thē already agayne ſayeth wrath iniquitie ſaying poynteth crueltie whiche hee vpbrayded wrath muche ſay chaſe agaynſt mee greeue hebrew worde may ſignifie iniquitie affliction iob declareth friēds come vnto compaſsion miſerie rather chafe yea grieue vexe imported ſwoorde ſayeth ſay god ſuffer ſuch outrage vnpuniſhed although offended yet ought curteous towards nowe condemning without cauſe ye ſhewe nothing rigorouſneſſe againſt therefore muſt god ſworde bee drawen againſt verely end ye may knowe iudgement behold notable profitable ſentence rebuking friendes ſorte iob prophet god ſpeaketh generally men common thing telleth v malicious iudge euill thing good churliſh tormenting vexing miſerable ynough already haue ſword god afrayd ſayd curſed call good euil euill good yet notwithſtanding wee ſee vice hath reigned time reygneth ſtil day caried affection conſcience make ſpite god openly haue skill ynough ſay ſee cace good ynough ſelfe yet notwithſtanding go quite cleane againſt suche man deſirous ſerue god ſtop thing myght bee buylding vp churche ſerue maynteyning felowſhip among men furtherance common weale ouerthrow euery whit yee ſhall ſee ſome euen thoſe ſitte ſeate iuſtice good diuels incarnate ſpiting god ouerthrowing al equitie right ful corruption outrage ſith wee ſee ſayd come top wickedneſſe much ſayd men bee ſeene ther nother great ſmall worke ſpite againſt god ſayd diuell poſſeſſeth men ſith giue themſelues ſo ouerthrow goodneſſe mainteyne euil ſpecially ſeeing ſo horrible curſe pronounced mouthe prophete againſt ſuche ſhall ſay euill good good euill iob ment heere ſaying ye afrayde ſword whome ſpeaketh ſuch puffed vp againſt god againſte right againſt whome wee make warre agaynſt god wee go aboute turne lyght intoo darkeneſſe woulde oppreſſe good cace beholde god whome wee aſſayle wee haue good cauſe bee afrayde yea though wee trouble ſome one poore man heaping ſome newe vexacion vppon hym god ſetteth himſelfe agaynſt v hee ſayeth hee cannot away ſuche violence extorcion vvhen menne go aboute outrage wrong poore folkes god ſteppeth ſheweth hymſelfe bee theyr defender therefore whenſoeuer wee bee tempted greeue trouble poore folkes ſuch aduerſitie alreadye ought theſe woordes make v tremble ſhall come minde god ſworde drawne agaynſt ſuche increace miſerie thoſe muche miſerie already beholde howe god defieth thoſe gyuen wrong violence extortion ſuch lyke thyngs ſee howe ſummoneth fire bloud alſo wee ſee poore man vnderfoote body ſupporteth hym let v afrayde treade vpon hym wrong reproch god auoucheth hee hath ſwoord drawen ſuche ſhall vexe good innocent folke ſorte iob ſpeaketh concluſion ſaying wrath iniquitie ſhall bring ſwoord hee ſhoulde ſay true nowe menne ouerleape boundes trouble good folkes ſeemeth themſelues ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed ſo nother feare god iudgement ſayeth ſwoorde readie therefore lette v ſtande ſo much owne conceyt beare ſelues hande god cannot come v haue ſo tormented poore folk ſeeke nothing liue quiet haue offended v thing wee fall ſtinging ſhewing ſelues bitter towards god bee hundred thouſandfold bitterer vnto v ſhal feele ſo wee come oure iudge vvere well weyed ſurely thing would go far otherwiſe world thā vve ſee prince ambition ſake fall waſting country burning houſes deſtroying townes robbing rauiſhing ſpoyling thing ſo horrible ſeene wherefore lawfull vnder name warre firſt formoſt ſhould conſider whither compelled ſtirre ſuch broiles make warre maner whole world howbeit foraſmuch none thyng ambition inflameth therevnto al thoſe miſchieues muſt ſpring rage wherwith moued thinke ſwoorde readie againe touching thoſe ſerue theyr luſtes feede humour thinke god ought drawe ſword vpon let v looke vpon onely ſee thoſe nother king prince abilitie make hauock country enter vpon force withſtanding ceaſſe full malice rather fuller play little scorpion whiche cannot hurt otherwiſe caſt poyſon tayles ſee euery man ſeeketh anoy trouble therefore muſt men needes feele ſaid heere wit ſword drawne againſt ſuch manner folke ſo yee ſee iob doth purpoſely ſay intēt ye ſhould know true theſe men doltes ſuch knew god heauen iudge worlde men skill experience wee haue ſeene talke ſhall ſee heereafter god leaue vvhy doth iob ſay vnto intent yee ſhould know bycauſe men beyng blinded theyr naughty affection know god beleeue whē haue drawne curtayne betweene god themſelues god ſhould ſee able puniſh deſerue lette v looke vppon ſworde althoughe wee ſee yet wyth eye ſay although god yet ſhewe v ſignes mynded puniſhe v make v knowe hee iudge worlde lette v thinke hee deſirous drawe v hym ſhewe hee vſe exceſsiue rigoure towardes v ſpecially wee bee rigorous towardes neighbour furthermore lette v vnderſtande ynough v abſteyne euill behoueth alſo helpe ſuche aduerſitie though man coulde proteſt hath abſteyned iniurie wrong yet ſhall therfore diſcharged god hee oughte help ſuccour thoſe haue neede ſuccoure haue abſteyned euill quit god hilde offender pray ſhall ſay thoſe nothyng elſe practiſe miſcheefe day night alwayes deuiſing howe may trouble vexe man man vvhen wicked men ſo ſharpen wit ſet purpoſe hurt neighbour reaſon god ſworde ſhould ſharpened againſte let v bethinke ſelues bee ready releeue ſuche neceſsititie alſo aſmuch ſo muche miſerie wretchedneſſe whole world let v haue pitie compaſſion farre let oure ſight extende euen thither accordingly charitie ought inflame mankind let v pray god vouchſafe pittie ſo diſtreſſed hath chaſtized roddes bring home himſelfe make turne ſaluation ſomuch whereas wee haue occaſion ſigh may reioyce togither prayſe name one common accord let v caſt ſelues downe preſence good god acknowledgemente oure faultes praying make v feele thē ſuch wiſe may haue regard amend therewithall euery one v may haue mynde humble himſelfe vnder god mightie hand ſteade condemning others learne feele euilles ſelues ſo may ſeeke purge clenſe v till haue clothed v fully owne rightuouſneſſe ſo let v ſay almighty god heauenly father c lxxiij sermon first vpon xx chapter sophar naamathite anſvvered ſayd 2 thought inforce anſvvere haſtineſſe mee 3 haue heard correction reproche ſpirite myne vnderſtanding enforceth anſvvere 4 haſt thou knovvne time old ſince god placed man vpon earth 5 aduauncement vvicked ſhort time ioy hypocrite ſhall indure 6 though lifted vp heauen haue rayſed head aboue cloudes 7 yet ſhall periſh ovvne dung haue ſeene thē ſhall ſay vvhere wee may better profite thys doctrine wee haue beare mynde hath bene declared ſuche incountered iob ſaying god leaueth wicked vnpuniſhed haue taken grounde true ſelfe applyed amiſſe perſone iob cauſe ought pray alwayes vnto god giue v skill diſcretion know howe apply thing rightly ſhall haue learned god word wee may turne thing euill might profite according ſee number abuſe holy ſcripture croſſely ouerthwartly▪ therefore ſtandeth v hand marke poynt ſhall ſee heere good profitable inſtructions effect whiche sophar ſayeth heere althoughe wicked deſpizers god bee ſeene proſper heere whyle yet muſt periſh end muſt miſerable according hath alwayes bene ſeene put vre god execute iudgements world end • hath done afore ere come poynt▪ hee vſeth preface wit inforced anſwer compelled ſo well ſpirit vnderſtanding alſo bycauſe aſhamed ſo checked iobs hand ſpecially ſith knew himſelfe ſayeth owne ſayings true iob reaſoneth contrary ſo▪ sophar good reaſon firſt god giueth v grace intent ſame ſhould ſerue ſelues alone ought make neyghbours partaker god giue vnderſtanding one man another ought keepe himſelfe alone looke gift god beſtoweth vpon v wee muſte labour communicate oure neyghbours may bee edified well ſelues god bee honoured one common conſent paule alſo ſheweth ſame namely man haue receyued gifte god hath receiued himſelfe▪ muſt apply wholly common vſe behold alſo howe god haue charitie exercyſed euery man ſhould like well himſelfe deſpyze neyghbours poynt ſhould wee bee bodie churche meete member ſhould bee knit togither meete ſhould bee referred head lette v marke well whereas sophar ſayeth ſpirite vnderstanding inforced anſwere ſo god gouerned thys ſaying rightly placed hee reaſon ſay ſo ſayd god ſhall haue diſcloſed good thing vntoo v ſame muſt bee drowned v rather wee muſt bring light heere yee ſee ſayde wee haue beleeued muſt ſpeake fayth muſte bee dead thing ſhe muſt vtter hir ſelfe paule dothe well verefie ſayd ſentence pſalme hee ſheweth lawfull doo bycauſe god giuen vnderſtanding whiche ought ſerue whole world therefore vttereth treaſure committed knowing well particular thing one man profite inſtruction whole church verely euery one v muſt applye leſſon himſelfe ſhall ſee many ſay ynough euerye man beleeue owne hart would ſay thing god hath ioyned togither might ſeparated men wee haue ſeene alreadie recorde dauid ſuch beleeue ought ſpeake except doo ſo ſhew malice doo burie thyng whiche god woulde haue publiſhed abroade according • ſayde men light candle put vnder buſſhell hide ſet vpon candelſticke may ſhine al furthermore nowe then▪ man hath receyued gift thinketh •• win himſelfe credite eſtimation aboue man contrariwiſe ſo diſgrace god gift making ſerue vainglory purpoſe god dealeth gift one another end wee ſhoulde men good therefore let euery v haue care aduaunce ſpread abrode whiche god hath committed vnto haue receyued ſo much let neuertheleſſe brought meanes ſaluation wherevnto god calleth v ende hee might bee glorified among v marke one poynt yet muſte poynt preſſe v sophar ſayeth hee heard correction reproch ſpeaketh reſpect owne perſone onely according matter hee dealt hee angrie ſee god truth troden meanes vnder foote iob ſuch intent haue declared alreadye therefore sophar dyd hym great wrong neuertheleſſe thys doctrine continueth ſelfe alwayes good true wee muſt holde ſo holy ghoſt alſo ment teach v man blinded owne imagination notwithſtanding ceaſſed haue good groundes thys doctrine taken may ſtand v ſteade notwithſtanding ſee reproue good fight agaynſt god truth reſiſting cauils thing miſapplyed therefore like befalleth v muſt withſtand much ſay whenſoeuer ſee man ſtriue againſt god truth wee muſt ſet ourſelues againſt aduerſarie party vvhy ſo god giue v wherewith make ourſelues proctor witneſſes haue cace maynteyned v honour great done v behalfe god ſeeth wee bee full vanitie nothing vntruth v yet neuertheleſſe calleth v proctor ought ſo boūd no▪ mind honour v ſo far foorth vvhat remayneth euery v ſtreyne himſelfe vttermoſt dutie vvhen wee ſee men ſo malicious wicked lift vp themſelues againſt god ſeeke meanes poſsible peruert corrupt truth meete v bee ſlouthfull vve ſee day pope hath many ſeducers whiche ſeeke nothing ſlaunder good doctrine falſifie euer alledge name god yea wee neede go ſo farre ſee malicious head euery vnderlings satan whiche turkin thing deſire nothing turne vpſide downe ſee diuell working ſort ouerthrowe thing good edifie church mē ſo impoyſoned againſt ought holde oure peace reſiſt ſtoutly much v lyeth yes certenly elſe ſhould cowardes yea ſhould imputed v high treaſon ſhoulde ſuffer god truth bee ſo defaced wee maynteyne opinion better hold peace ſpeake agaynſte papiſts ſuperſtitions yea meane ſee howe diuell would abuſe ſilence vtter foorth lye tirannies continually poore ſoules periſh meane hold tung ſhall become it▪ ſhepeheard duetie wil ſuffer woolues theeues enter flocke ſcare byte deuoure yet ſay neuer word god hath appoynted v ſheepeheards church▪ like wee muſte haue ſweete amiable voyce guide oure flocke withall leade ſuch ſaluation teachable obedient ſo alſo contrary part wee ſee theeues vvoolues muſt crie aloude ſcare away ye ſee ſuch perceyue men peruert god truth ought diſſemble rather earneſt zelous reſiſting vttermoſt power agayne ought haue ſuch courage conſtancie maynteyning good caces againſt trumpery ſuttleties wicked pray ought wee ſpeake ſtill like behalfe wee ſee god name blaſphemed deede good doctrine ſcorned rayled vpon • ewde lyfe malapertneſſe euer wicked folke take hand vvould god neceſsitie conſtreyned v ſo muche doth vvhen man hath preached woorde god let go abroade ſtreates marke ſeeth ech man openly ſene euery man hath conſpired againſt god fyre water contrarie common lyfe leade doctrine preached ſay reachleſſe men heare although ſet face vpon matter ceremoniouſly pretende god ſhall honored word receyued yet appeereth playing little child men throughly mocke god common lyfe doo nothing elſe deſpyze word vve neede decyfer thing peecemeale men ſee well ynough wee dulheaded grieued v ſee god ſo ill obeyed among v ſo ſmally reuerenced men handes ſpecially ſeeing thing come ſhamefulneſſe sophar ſpeaketh namely onely god diſhonored whoredome looceneſſe lyfe blaſphemie robbery ſuch thing reigne puniſhed ought bee alſo euen puniſhment extended men finde theyr hart mocke god iuſtice ſpeake whyche ſawe yeſterday myne eye ſtrumpet bee put priſon ſhee muſt haue tartes caried hir feaſt hir withall ſhe muſt locked vp countenauce meane whyle ſhee muſt preſented great tartes▪ pray dealing onely bene tolde bene • oulted yet could haue hild peace ſaw ſelfe myne owne eye ſomuch may ſeeme god brought diuell ment make triūphes ſide maruell though ſuch haue charge lordes flocke preache hys woorde ſpeake ſo roughly ſith ſee thing ſo farre ſquare nother modeſtie honeſtie ho yet blameable god ſpeake hundreth part ought conſidering diſorder ſo outrageous ſee vvherefore let v marke well ſentence sophars ſayde could holde pe ••• inforced ſpeake bicauſe hee chafed wyth reproch▪ wee muſt ſuffer euill haue ſuch ſcope without ſetting ſelues againſt without ſhewing ſelues haue ſome zele god maynteyning glory truth let v come generall matter layd foorth heere▪ haſt thou knowne time old ſayeth sophar euē ſince god ſet man vppon earth highneſſe wicked ſhorte time ioy hypocrite tranſgreſſors ſhall indure hee taketh heere principle good true whiche wee take life deſpyzers god happie wee deceyued happineſſe dreame adde ſimilitude true moſt men wyll ſay wicked vnhappie wee ouerſhoote ourſelues wee ſee man liue eaſily honour although life bee ruled according god word yet notwithſtanding rauiſhed thinke ſtate good wiſhed euery man ſpite yea meane whyle knowe ſuch ſo aduaunced snayles ſayd pſalme compariſon well worthy noted dauid ſayeth ſuch bee aduaunced world haue liuely roote ſettled god snayles come creeping vp one night vaniſhe away hand behold heere snayles porredge haue conſideration wee leaue principall poynt looke vnto end haue pacience ſay well god aduaunceth whome wil breake neckes greater • owler fall vve good skill wheele fortune wee cannot referre thyngs god prouidence beholde hys workes yeelde hym praiſe muche therefore haue wee neede marke well ſentence euer ſince god ſet man vpon earth hath bin found continuall experience highneſſe hypocrite late tyme ioy ſhall indure euer vvhen sophar ſayeth thing bee knowne long experience hath bene ſo euer ſince god created worlde ſaying great weyght wee ſee two three example god iuſtice ought wee bee touched ynough heere much three foure perſones onely god ſheweth hee leaue wicked vnpuniſhed hee ſheweth euery day hath ſhewed borne wee purſue age age ſince creation world wee ſhall ſee god hath alwayes kepte ſame rate seeyng wee haue ſuche example ſo greate ſo long continuance god hathe alwayes ſhewed himſelfe iudger wicked mennes proſperitie made thing turne confuzion decay reaſon wee ſhoulde yet ſtill doubt vvherefore lette v marke well ſaying howe importeth much truthe ſay time ſince men dwelt vppon earth hath bin god wyll ther ſhould alwayes ſome recordes iudgements therefore wee muſt bee ſo dull blockiſh conſider thing god hath done inſtruction heerevppon wee ought gather ynough v haue eye open marke vewe well thing god dothe oure owne life tyme muſt alſo profite auncient hyſtories verely heere ſee lordes wee ſhould haue ſome notable iudgementes lefte v wryting namely ende remembrance ſhould remayne euer yea wee muſte onely profite ourſelues thing conteyned holy scripture alſo heare ſtories rehearced written heathen men wee muſt haue skill apply god doings ſelues wee ſee hath executed vengeance vpon ſuch gyuen crueltie robberie extorcions therewithall hath puniſhed whoredome filthineſſe whē reigned ouerſore finally wee ſee hath puniſhed periuries outrage men pryde hath exceeded ſo farre coulde longer borne looke vpō ſuch thing ought ſerue turne day alſo let v remember well leſſon giuen v heere namely ſomuch god hath euer ſince creation worlde tyme tyme giuen v ſome warning ſhewe v hee iudge world muſt learne ſtande awe hym walke warely puniſhments hee hath executed vpon wicked may lookingglaſſes v brydles reſtrayne v nowe lette v returne hee ſayeth highneſſe wicked ſhort tyme although lifted vp heauen reached vp clowdes head yet ſhuld continue god would throw downe hand heere iob continueth matter ſawe wit god wil ſuffer wicked aduaunced floriſh ſhall indure long sophar conſidered thys well would haue ſtoode contention wyth iob foraſmuch taketh generall ſentence applyeth amiſſe goeth ouerthwartly worke yet notwithſtanding haue ſayd doctrine deſerueth bee receyued comming holy ghoſt v doo looke aduiſedly vpon apply conueniently therefore let v go foreward matter troublous temptation v ſee wicked proſperitie would fayne god ſhould ſhew himſelfe wit cannot away wicked throweth downe bycauſe hateth abhorreth ſelues amiſſe would haue god ſpare v none v thinketh god ouerhaſtie puniſhing v vvhen haue committed one ſin two three god chaſtize v thinke ſoone wee cannot away another man haue done neuer ſo little faulte would haue god thunder vpō hande lo wherevnto hypocriſie leadeth v done contrary part vve muſt bee contented ſee wicked triumph tyme worlde haue full ſcope liue eaſe pleaſure bee greeued although wee ſelues bee meane whyle aduerſitie trouble meane god intendeth trie fayth wee ſawe thing bee ſuche ſhall bee ende god ſheweth v thē word would put truſt vve would beleeue nothing til ſaw perceyue thing god ſpeaketh ſo ſoone wee would yet neuertheleſſe continue ſtill ſtedfaſt hys word reſting vpon hath proceeded hys mouth▪ thing wherein wee ſhew ſelues beleeue ſo let v marke well god doth ſo lay brydle vpon wicked vngodly folkes neckes trie whither haue ſerued purely whither haue paciently giuen leaue doo without lifting vp ſelues againſt alſo yet god haue v learne paradiſe world would faine liue pleaſure god ſhould dandle v lyke little cockneyes behoofe cleane cō trary vnleſſe god drew v affliction wee would neuer good willes fleete world much intangled may therefore wee haue neede bee drawen heauenly kingdome many tribulation god ſhoulde inforce v come yet therewithall alſo ſhewe v hee roote wicked though runne ryot neuer ſo much vvhen ſee wee ſhall haue cauſe beare grudge haue ſayd already let v learne ouercome ſayd temptation trumped way wicked happen bee aduaunced yea euen reaching clowdes wyth theyr head let v vnderſtand muſt bee grieued though god aſleepe though regarded world ne care contrariwiſe let v aſſure ſelues god lifting vp ſtrike quite downe one blow yea euen deadly fall falling ſtand vppon feete might well ſcape breaking ſome bone god ſuffereth hoyſed vp ſo high ſendeth downe vtter deſtruction thus ye ſee intent sophar ſayeth loftineſſe wicked ſhort tyme nowe hee addeth ioy ſhall bee of▪ long continuance vvhereby meeneth deſpyzers god al ſuch tyed world ouer ioy themſelues preſent proſperitie vtterly drunken wyth true child god may well bee merie haue proſperitie like whē god ſendeth v wherewith fed maynteyned hee dealeth ſo v want nothing giueth v health quietneſſe like thing may well mery yea ought bee ſo according ſayde law thou ſhalt eate drinke thy god bee mery yet muſt faythfull ſettle ioy vpon preſent benefites hold themſelues tyed vnto yea rather want meate drinke bee troubled ſickneſſe muſt therefore ceaſſe truſt god muſt learne paules leſſon whiche haue skill poore rich indure hunger ſcarcitie alſo haue abundance thus ye ſee mirth god child differeth greatly mirth vnbeleeuers worldling theſe reioyce thing hold hande without looking god heauenly life haue care beſotte themſelues ſuch ſort find eaſe run ryot extreeme looceneſſe lyfe contrary wiſe faythfull proſperitie always led wit acknowledging god goodneſſe hee hath made feele father towards thē know alſo may ſeeme haue forſaken thē neereſt ſuccour thys ſentence sophar ment ſhew deſpizers god thoſe giuen euill aduaunced fortune terme hir laugheth vpon ſo proſper liue eaſe bee ſo dulled mirth drunkenneſſe runne ryot without order meaſure lo sophar ment ſpeake purpoſe let v marke well lord ieſus chriſt ſayeth wo laugh ſhall weepe mirth ſhalbe turned gnaſhing teeth lawfull v merrie ſayd afore lawfull v reioyce god giueth v occaſion merrie let v iames willeth v let merrie ſing ſay let giue god thanks calling vpon let alwayes ſtill go foreward towards ſtabliſhed loue feare truſt towards ye ſee mirth ought way ſayd mirth wee muſt alſo bee ſadde conſidering wee ceaſſe offend god paule alſo ſheweth v example conſidering vice v ſo let v alwayes
