go onward ſtill full perfect ioy hidden v yet thus muche concerning ſaying ioy wicked ſhall indure long furthermore let v mark sophar beguyled miſtaking theſe word ſhort time ſmall continuance scripture ſayeth wicked vaniſh away god conſume turning hand ment keepeth one ordinarie ſtint haue declared already god ſhould ſo ſhould reſerued till latter day would wedded world wayte comming lord ieſus chriſt accompliſh reſurrection redemption lord therefore fayne reſerue many yea moſt parte thing till hys laſt iudgement yet meane alwayes office deſtroy wicked ſhew ſhort continuance good ſooth let v conſider well oure life wee ſhall ſe • thyng laſteth longeſt time worlde doth paſſe ſlip away turning hand vvee bee ſuche fooles god lift vp hand firſt day deſtroy ſuch haue offended wee opinion time neuer come ſeemeth v life laſteth long yet graunt ſhadow euery man muſt away hence ſpite teeth therefore ſayd vnto v wicked continue long tyme lette v learne meant oure lorde riddes hand although come yeeres fiftie threeſcore yet ceaſſe bee trayned ſtill god hand decay confuzion bee ſhorte wee muſte bee pacient wayte ſilence god without ſuch boyling haſtineſſe sophar wont vſe heere behold ſay howe behoueth v apply doctrine wee intend fare better truly right neceſſarie poynt v wee ſhall ſee many offended reading promiſes holy scripture god bliſſe thoſe leade wayes bring deuices good ende ſhall liue proſperitie ſhall bee bliſſed hande themſelues ofſpring cattle home abroade poſſeſsions ſhall bee preſerued grace god contrarie part ſee child god indure ſo great ſcarcitie ſo many miſeries rufull sometime haue ſo much one morſell bread put mouth ſmirten diſeaſes al calamity meane time wicked whome god threatned doe proſper vve aſtoniſhed wee ſeeme loſe time truſting vnto god threatenings promiſes deceytfull vvhat cauſe ſuche trouble want pacience bridle ourſelues ſay wil ſee god vve need ſtride ouer wee haue paſſe diche bee fayne leape ſtryde wee maye get ouer much leape ouer thing worlde ſo lift vp ſelues beholde god iudgements therefore cannot ſee though neere hand certeſſe diuers ſay go ſuch thing ſtoppeth ſtop ſome ſtrawe lyeth way let yet needed lift vp foote treade vpon ouercome matter make ſo great adoe great lazineſſe v howbeit deſtitute god ſpirit yee ſee plight yet thing conteyned holie ſcripture ſpoken vaine without cauſe furthermore behoueth v marke alſo howe zophar ſayeth heere wicked ſhall haue lifted vp heade skie reached cloud god find meanes well inough throw downe yea ſinke euen hell lo end wicked ſhall ſeeke nothing aduaunce themſelues true god doth erewhiles exalt ſeruantes honour dignitie yet ceaſſe lowely ſtill vvhen man gouerned god ſpirit although great prince honoured whole worlde god hath reached hande exalt highly yet hee always modeſtly mynded acknowledge infirmity walke feare wareneſſe ſaying ala would become god brydled mee giueth grace haue nothing myne haue cauſe glorifie ſelfe neerer commeth doth bynde ſo honored among men behoueth mirrour ſaue ſuch deſtroyed ouerthrowne god hath ſette cace ende ſhould ſerue turnes haue neede helpe thus child god indued grace meene keepe themſelues ſerue owne peculiar turne withall acquaint themſelues neighbor yea euē meaneſt according saint paule ſpeaketh humble themſelues loweſt god hath commaunded cleane contrarie whē wicked happen bee aduaunced doe nothing lift vp heades cloudes perke vp vnto heauen whereof commeth bycauſe haue forgotten themſelues thinke themſelues bee mortall men take themſelues ye would ſay god vve ſee theſe blinde wretch ſotted pryde namely knowe themſelues one ſpake men thinke forgotten zophar meeneth ſaying wicked lift vp head vnto sky perke aboue cloudes true behoueth v reach heades aboue skyes aboue cloud another manner wit although bee wayfarer worlde ſee nothing corruption ſelues yet wee muſt fayle poſſeſſe hope euerlaſting benefites god hath promiſed v muſt bee able proteſt paule wee citizen heauen heritage prepared v alreadie alreadie ſet heauenly place namely perſon head ieſus chriſte hath knit vnited v ſelf neuer ſeparated thus ye ſee howe faythfull child god muſt lift vp head heauen alſo aboue heauen yet notwithſtanding mente heereby ſhould humble themſelues according ſayde ſhall alwayes ſtoupe vnto god prophet amos ſpeaketh meneth ſaying god haue v ſtoupe vnder intent wee ſhould know ſuch burthen vpon ſhoulders wee able beare mainteined power ſurely neceſſarie v end may glorified v deliuering v ſorte miſeries aduerſities wherewith wee bee ſo ouerloden borne downe therefore let v marke wel theſe thing ende may learne frame ourſelues ſuch myldneſſe wee may bee number thoſe whome god lift vp heauen hee hath caſt downe vnto hell vphild hand god let v humble ſelues apoſtle ſayth yea let v humble ſelues ſuch ſort may firſt yelde god glorie belongeth vnto whome goodneſſe proceedeth make true confeſsion vnto ſecondly haue euery one v eye calling knowing god hathe knit v ſuch wiſe togither greateſt ought apply themſelues leaſt euery v ought put god giftes ſuche vſe may take good common aſſuring oure ſelues condition wherevpon bee giuen v others ſhould bee partaker well vvhen wee goe worke ſort certaine wee ſhall bee alwayes vphilde hande god although diuell make neuer ſo great aſſaultes vpon v yet ſhall holde againe though wee bee ſayne ſtagger nowe yet god alwayes readie hande ſo ſhall euermore get victorie howeſoeuer world go therefore hilde ſuch modeſtie becommeth v let v aſſure ſelues god cauſe v feele power making v continue goodneſſe euen ende although muſt fayne walke many hazardes daungers worlde yet hee ſuffer v ruſh againſt euill incounters break necke meete ſurely giue v grace leape ouer ſayde afore thus muche haue wee gather theſe wordes zophar preſent time nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ou • faultes praying make v ſo feele thereby may taught miſlike ſelues ſith wee ſo wretched creature ceaſſe offend therewithall may true lowlyneſſe receyue chaſtizementes ſhall ſend v ſo may dayly ſtoup vnder mightie hand ſo ſtricken may notwithſtanding ceaſſe walke hee commaundeth heart myndes lifted vp faith hope vnto kingdome heauen continuing neuertheleſſe little one world howe babe witte babe malice intent bereft vaine preſumption ſelfeliking wee may ſo ſerue one another god may honored v one accorde may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people c lxxiiij sermon ſecond vpon xx chapter sermon goeth expoſition vij verſe text added heere 8 hee ſhall vaniſhe avvay dreame found againe ſhall paſſe avvay viſion night 9 eye hath ſeene ſhall ſee place ſhall knovv 10 child ſhall faune vpon poore hand ſhall reſtore rich 11 bone ſhall full youth ſhall lie dovvne vvith duſt 12 euill ſvveete mouth vvill hide vnder toung 13 vvill ſpare let go keepe mids palate 14 meate bovvels ſhall turned gall adder vvithin 15 hath ſvvallovved vp rich hee ſhall ſpue vp againe god ſhall plucke bellie heere sophar go forward doctrine glaunced yeſterday witte wheras wicked deſpyzers god ſeeme bee happie ſame ſhall laſte long bycauſe god muſt put hande confound end vſeth phraſe whiche may doe v vnderſtande ſhall periſhe owne turning elſe owne dung ſo doe hebrew terme turning ſayd ſhall go dung ſpeake way diſdeine reproch ye ſee meening ſay although deſpyzers god braue make ſelues terrible yet muſt periſh ſhame ynough caſt men remoue dung lo ſenſe afterward addeth ſhal periſh neuer recouer made whole againe herevpon likeneth dream viſion night paſſeth away incontinent ſhort ſaith ſuch haue ſeen great eſtate authoritie ſhall knowe nother ſhall bee hope recouer place againe haue declared verie true happineſſe appeereth wicked ſhall end turne greater confuzion much bee curſed god bee muſt needes come euill ende vvhat cauſe men happineſſe bycauſe god receyueth fauour bliſſeth wee haue contrarie ſo hee ſhake v although whole world ſeeme ſide thing fall contentation tootoo well needes muſte benefites poſsible v haue turned vndoing therefore fountaine welfare onely goodneſſe loue god haue although ſeeme neuer ſo wretched yet ſhall thing turne welfare cleane contrariwiſe god loue v impoſsible ſhould meanes proſper vvee may well haue ſome outward ſhewe ſhall cōtinuance▪ ſhewed v therfore let v mark wel ſpech sophar vſeth although betoken two thing haue ſayde yet notwithſtanding importeth god ouerthroweth wicked turning hande deſerueth noted bycauſe ſeeme faſtned yron nayles ſay ſo may neuer remoued god finde meanes throwe downe yea euen vpon ſuddeine men aware thing ſhall ſeeme impoſsible v god able work beyond imagination conceit againe let v learne bleared gloriouſneſſe dignitie wicked ſeeing lorde caſteth teeth ſee doth world highly cōmend ſuch inriched robberie ſuch aduaunced wicked practizes ſuche deſpyze god equitie right behold holie ghoſt likeneth dung filth haue touched let v bee tempted ſee greatneſſe excellencie deſpyzers god rather let v hearken ſaying holie ghoſte vttereth againſt put eſtimation without cauſe bicauſe wee ſhould repine ſtate drawne line luſts would euerie blow finally bee diſquieted though god executed iuſtice world aſleep heauen liſted repreſſe wickedneſſe ouerfloweth bank therfore ende ſuche temptation haue dominion ouer v let v learn eſteeme thoſe thing dung filth world hath great reputation lo wee haue ſee men clap handes wicked maner honour god therfore meane let v pacient wayting ende aſſuring ſelues dung afore god alſo poynt bee noted namely place ſhall knowe eye hathe ſeene ſhall ſee vvhereby sophar meeneth wicked ſhall afflicted ſmall time like god doeth oftentimes afflicte faythfull alſo ſuch wiſe may ſeeme bee vtterly ouerwhelmed may ſeeme god minded confound owne ſeruants without anye hope ſetting vp againe yet haue promis although bottom hell hande god ſhould ſtretch ſelfe thither drawe vvherefore though wee muſt bee faine walke middes ſhadowe death yet let v diſmayed ſeing god giueth v token redeemer wit ſith heare voyce god warranting v hath forgotten v lo haue ſide although god giue wicked ſomuch little fillup wound ſo deadly neuer recouer god ſpeaketh deſtroy yea euē ſuch wiſe man may bee able ſet eſtate build vp againe vvell may men attempt ſhall preuayle thinke plucke backe thus ſee sophar ſholeth deſpizers god wicked ſort frō faythfull affliction may well light vpon alike oddes end ſay affliction light vpon one wel inſomuch faythfull ſhall ſeeme verie point periſh vtterly without recouerie howbeit muche god hath promiſed reach hande although come euen deathe yet ſhould bee rayzed vp againe wicked muſt periſh vtterly curſe god vpon therefore let v learne comfort ſelues god ſhall ſende v affliction although great hard heauie yet cauſe gladneſſe ſith end ſhall happie ſide ſee wicked floriſhe triumph let v ceaſſe keepe pace notwithſtanding miſerable worldward god ſtriketh vpon ſuddein ſet vp againe muſt lie ſtill place ſhal neuer acquainted ſaide full ſeuen thirtith pſalme inaſmuch hard thing beleeued god deſtroy wicked euen bee ſo well ſettled life maye ſeeme ſhould continue •• ate euer holie ghoſt fayne drawe v backe oftentimes leſſon ende may bee throughly ſettled heart fully perſuaded wee perceiue 〈…〉 te god raze wicked without euer ſuffering recouer vp againe let v herken scripture ſayth wee ſhall perceiue god rooteth ſuche ſorte menne ſhall wote become thus muche concerning sophars wordes hee ſayeth place wicked ſhall knowe alſo compariſon dreame night phancies menne conceyue true life man ſelfe may well called dreame doe men heere vntill oure lord haue inlightened made knowe ordeyned better life vvhat ſay onely dreame ſuche weene get wealth heape vp rich heere bylowe ceaſſe runne ſeeking heere make large circuites yet notwithſtanding come always one point thinke vpon nothing elſe gathering dreame vvhat vice ſo euer men infected pray haue certeine mark reſting place ſo long bee intangled world haue cleere mind vnderſtand god calleth haue thought well ſettled haue affection well ordered dreame ſhort thing well ſerched peecemeale men purpoſe deuiſe take hande doe would bee founde whole ſtate like dreame fancie man conceyueth haue ſayde ſuch may mannes life generally ſayd ſpecially may verefied thoſe hold aloofe god turne back vpon much leaue light wilfully ſeeke darkeneſſe▪ meete haue ſuch wage deſerue wit haue wit confounded ſo may able iudge thing diſcerne betweene white blacke rather ouerſpred continuall night doe nothing elſe dreame deede wee ſee alſo howe tranſforme thinges turne cleane contrarie marke deſpizer god hee beare himſelfe hand able worke wonder yet meane knoweth god enimie muſt need periſh may wel fortifie himſelf ſhal able ſcape god hand fall vpon hideous ſtorme ſaid forſomuch wicked ſhun light aſmuch deſerue god ſhuld caſt vnlightſome place continual night wrapped round darkeneſſe haue mind ſo dazeled conceiue dreames fancy make themſelues beleue without cauſe holy ghoſt doth mouth sophar liken wicked vnto dreame onely diſguiſe themſelues ſorte ſee men alſo haue falſe opinion thē ▪ wicked man aduanced euery man reuerenceth yea enuie ſtate would 〈…〉 ne lyke ſuch come doe oftentimes make idole thus yee ſee cace menne ſee wycked proſper wee conſider within haue woorme gnaweth without ende ceaſsing bycauſe god iuſtice followeth harde heeles alwayes troubled conſciences knowe wee perplexitie vnquietneſſe wicked bycauſe god hath curſed wee bee bleared certeine vayno ſhewe prouerbe ſayth gliſtereth eyther golde ſiluer eye let v learne remember ſhewed v heere wit wee muſt dreame bee ſo led owne miſweening fancie god skorne ſuch vanitie ſhewe end haue bene darkneſſe day come wherein wee ſhall bee brought light daye commeth men ſhall ſee howe haue bene beguiled dreames nowe night god inlighteneth v leaſtwiſe let ſelues vvhat maketh v dreame cauſe ſo deceyued owne fonde imagination euery one v forgeth ſome fancie ſelf loth ſtay ſelues conſider god doth dally eye ſpecially hee warneth v worde beholde howe god ſheweth v true happineſſe true welfare bliſſed man ſayth hee feareth lorde bliſſed man applieth himſelf minding god truth bliſſed man putteth whole truſte god ſhall bee like tree planted ryuers ſide alwayes full good ſappe ſo nother heate drought maye cauſe forgoe freſhneſſe luſtineſſe thus doth lorde ſhewe v true happineſſe may knowe ſelues blame fugitiue cannot reſt vpon firme ground needes haue happineſſe ſlipperie flyghtfull therefore well worthy periſhe tumble bottomleſſe pit ſith goe ſo wilfully ſeeke darkeneſſe night thus ye ſee ſayde ſo muche god ſo gracious inlighten v worde behoueth v come away dreames fancy end toſſed ſo afterwarde ſayde bone full youth hebrewe word sophar vſeth heere doth ſometimes ſignifie hid ſecrete ſinnes ſurelye hebrewe worde ſignifieth youth deriued thence alſo ſo ſenſe may wicked man bone full ſinnes hath committed ſpecially hee began commit youth elſe youth bone full filled glutted pleaſures ſo heart deſire euer mynde vnto came hande wee haue note wee take worde youth owne ſignification meening firſt sophar warranteth wicked giuen vnto euill neuer returne backe agayne according ſayde salomon prouerbs yong man hath taken wrong way ſhall go ſtill commeth olde age ſhal continue al one vve ſee men haue takē way awry giue themſelues naughtineſſe verie hard plucke backe againe lo good profitable leſſon although common ynough talke verie heathen men haue made prouerbes yet haue wee neede bee warned conſidering howe ſo much giuen continue euill rufull thinke nothing perceiue howe satan taketh poſſeſsion v continue filthyneſſe vvhen man beginneth firſt euill thinketh followe ſtill day moneth yeare ſhall returne well ynough againe end verely though repentance ſleeue ſayde beholde satan creepeth v taketh poſſeſſion v ere aware therfore let v keepe v hardening ſo euill ſoone wee perceyue fleſh naughtie nature egge v prouoke v ſtep aſyde let v reſtreyned feare god falne let v doe endeuer get vp againe incontinently wee bee way let v returne ſay v delay till morrow ſpecially yong man ſtandeth vpon ordering life let well aduiſed gyue himſelfe ouer vice filthineſſe weene returne hee liſteth himſelfe hee deceyued yee ſee fyrſt thing wee haue marke wee muſt bee ſaped ſinnes nowe verie fitte manner ſpeaking ſay bone wicked full youth wit wicked onely haue ſome fleeting luſtes man ſhall ſee ſome folke haue anye malicious wilfulneſſe vtterly deſpyzers god haue ſtill ſome ſeede godneſſe would fayne giue themſelues weldoing howbeit muche haue holde themſelues conſtant aſſoone meete prouocation ſtreit ouerſhoote themſelues ſhall ſee ſome ſuch ſay sophar meeneth much heere wit haue bone full naughtineſſe within ſoked ſteeped delight themſelues ſee alſo diuell poiſoneth men ſtinging lightly ſheading venim bottome heart ſo witte vnderſtanding may conceyue nothing euill lo howe god puniſheth ſuch haue deſpyzed gyuen themſelues ouer euill ſo dayly appayre wex euer woorſe woorſe hereby ſee mannes choyce repent liſteth theſe ſcoffers ſay mocking god tuſh need one good ſigh end ſhal giue ſigh vvherefore let v beware welter ſinnes get bone intoo maree oure naughtineſſe goe v graue well may wee ſtryue againſt yet muſt fayne dwell ſtill olde skin therfore let v beware ſuch vengeance god light vpon v furthermore haue ſayde another leſſon v gather ſaying bone wicked full youth ſhall lie graue naughtineſſe ſhall lie ſayth sophar hereby meeneth wicked yee would ſay redie burſt fulneſſe goodes pleaſures god make leane ynough ſo ſhall wither away fayne go ſtarke naked graue ſerueth confirme matter diſcourſed long afore witte wicked haue owne wiſh cheefe iollitie ſo ſeeme bee happyeſt men whole world one bone bene full youth ſay god firſt giuen could wiſh afterward made lay themſelues downe ſleepe euen euery man himſelfe alone ſay bare carkeſſe god vncaſeth ſtripped ſtarke naked ſendeth graue hereby bee admoniſhed wee ſee wicked men haue meate drinke fill yea euen till burſt ſo rich flowe vnto deſire honored haue pleaſures ſay warned quiet wee ſee ſuch thing ſeing lord hath told v muſt ſo good reaſon ſhould paſſe ouer ſuch ſtumblingblockes ſhaken let v marke wel ende sophar ſheweth howe euerie one muſt goe lie downe alone himſelfe graue ſeeing ſo let v tarie till lord vncaſe wicked ſhal haue cauſe enuie ouerſhoote ourſelues ſayd common thing v goe duſt rot true howbeit haue good companie inaſmuch wee haue walked feare god life know yelde ſoules handes hee keepe well faithfully vve ſhall well accompanied much knowe angel god ſcripture telleth v ſhall receiue ſoules put ſaide good ſafe keeping vntill wee riſe againe heauenly glorie albeit outward apparance euerie one v cut world companie men layd graues yet ſhall well accompanied godward wee haue walked feare contrarie part wicked muſt lie ſtill duſt although haue great traines band e haue ye would ſay trayled long tayle yet muſt god bring ende declared afterward ſayd euill ſweete mouth holde vnder tong wil ſpare without ſwallowing downe keepe ſtill palate mouth ſhall turned gall adder bowel aſſoone haue ſwallowed ſhall ſpue vp againe among theſe thing hee ſpake alſo child wicked thing forgotten sophar therfore among thoſe thing ſayth wicked folkes child ſhall flatter poore handes ſhall restore rich bad poſſeſſed hereby hee doth v vnderſtande god vtter vengeance make felte onely perſons thoſe whome ſpeaketh alſo child according alſo scripture ſayeth god make iniquitie father come home boſomes child maye ſeeme firſt bluſhe agreeth god rightuouſneſſe ſoule hath ſinned ſhall beare puniſhment ſinnes ſaid ezechiel god puniſheth child ſinnes father hee doth ſo deede howbeit muſt preſuppoſe god doeth oftentimes owne gracious goodneſſe exempte child wicked ceaſſe bliſſe notwithſtanding deſerued bee curſed againe god intendeth performe iudgement whereof mention made heere hee letteth child wicked holde owne race ſteppes father reaſon whereof continually increaſe miſcheef ſo much vtterly voyde god ſpirite doe prouoke wrath continue heaping vp vengeance vpon themſelues according god executed vppon theyr father true verie cauſe god draweth backe holie ſpirit ſo might follow father bound tyed man let v thinke maner puniſhing ſtraunge whereof sophar ſpeaketh heere wit god ſhould impoueriſh wicked mennes child bring ſo lowe ebbe muſt fayne fawne euen vpon verieſt raſcals theyr father paſsingly proude ſo muche greateſt honorableſt ſorte durſt matche ſtoode awe according ſee ſuch haue heart ſo puffed vp pryde muſt need diſdeyne men ſeeing haue alreadie begonne deſpyze god vve ſee intollerable pryde voutſafe giue good looke ſuch come ſue make ſupplication vvell ſo child muſt bee fayne ſue verieſt raſcals ſay vengeance performed god ſuffereth child followe father thing right neceſſarie v knowe ende may conſider ſorte vengeance god vpon wicked ſeeing muſt alſo extend child like ſide perceyue infinite goodneſſe oure god pleaſeth bliſſe child make fele mercie ſakes excellent recorde loue beareth v contrarie part wee ſee fire wrath ſo kindled onely purſueth ſelues alſo ſpreadeth catcheth hold child alſo inough make haires ſtand vpright vpon head let v learne walk ſo much carefully feare god leaſt drawe ſayd horrible puniſhment vpon oure ſelues ofſpring herewithall let v vnderſtand alſo lord bliſſe ofſpring thoſe haue feared honored wee maye better courage giue ourſelues ſeruice whē ſee ſo liberall thinkes ynough make promiſſe v haue ſame extend child alſo behold ſay haue marke ſentence nowe conſequently ſayde handes ſhall restore rich agreeth sophar addeth namely hath hee deuowred hee must ſpewe vp againe god make restore thing hath ſwallowed vp mente heere wicked may well rake muche toogither ſhort tyme inriche themſelues ſhall neuer ſooner inioy goodes haue gotten eyther child muſt bee brought pouertie elſe themſelues muſt ſpue vp againe god tarie ſo long time making yeelde vp account ſeeme bee come full point purpoſe god muſt bee fayne doe cure vpon make caſt vp ſtomackes rid quite cleane great ſtore good raked togither vvee ſee verie many example hereof yet verie fewe thinke vpon ſay wee ſee men pilling ſcraping ſides vvell god giueth bridle ſo haue meanes occaſions inrich themſelues buy houſe landes turne pennie deale marchandize ſo ye ſee full well ſtuffed may haue ſwallowed vp come ſuch ſtorme worth hundred thouſand crounes ſhall find himſelf ſo diſtreſſed hee would bee glad ſcape ſafe bodie like poore man midds sea would giue goodes hee hathe hee might ſaue life euen ſo ſaye doeth god ſuffer rich choke men haue raked togither hangman elſe ſhal bereft impoueriſhed aſſoone commeth ſodeine ſtorme alſo ſee otherſome waſte away peecemeale truely men ſay ſee euill lucke beholde ſuch one verie rich ſped ſo well owne pollicie come ye ſee nowe ſuch miſfortune befalne ſuche man hath delte amiſſe hath made fooliſh bargaine elſe ieoparded much thus wee looke vpon meane cauſes ought go principall thing wee therein bewraye howe blind wee conſider ſuch manner men inriched crueltie extorciō craft deceit guile haue raked men goodes vnto without pitying widowes fatherleſſe verie cauſe turned good want knowing god hande althoughe ſhewe ſelfe wee turne vpſide downe vvherefore let v learne take better heede doe god giueth v ſuch example wit ſuch haue bene verie rich abated alſo delte withall god hee maketh caſt gorge ſo ſee impoueriſhed oure face let v acknowledge god layeth hande vpon whereas ſayde owne bandes ſhall restore rich howe commeth paſſe haue ſo ſwallowed vp thing doe ſtoupe ſo lowe reſtore haue raked togither owne handes meening owne accord wicked would neuer come poynt good will excepte god graunt ſpeciall grace acknowledge ala haue doone thoſe men great wrong whome haue ſo polled beguiled therefore muſt bethinke reſtore againe ſuche haue defrauded neygbours come poynt bliſsing god heere sophar ſpeaketh thoſe god curſeth howe ſhall hand reſtore thinges haue taken men knowe meanes whereby god maketh caſt gorge ſeeme vtterly deſtitute wit vnderſtanding whereas heretofore bene ſo skilfull dooing theyr buſineſſe coulde diſcourſe vppon matter howe lay afore hande ſay ſuch thing muſt bee done firſt haue thing doone waye muſt go worke haue bene politike gather themſelues ſides ſo ſhall yee ſee become ſtarke dolt ſo much ſhall ſeeme giue backe againe rich ſcraped togither though coſt nothing bee ſhorte man would ſay play little babe vndo thing true ſuch maner men ceaſſe bee couetous euer haue furnace ſtill burning ſo could find hart haue deuoured hundred world yet ſo blinded themſelues paſſe laſhe hilde ſo ſtreitly whereof commeth bycauſe god diſfurniſheth wit reaſon impoueriſh ſorte thus yee ſee wee haue marke firſt part ſentence although wicked ſwallowe vp thing maner deuouring one fleecing another ſeeming themſelues neuer haue ynough though good increaſe ſtill yet let v ceaſſe behold thing fayth ſee yet eye looke mee vpon wicked man inricheth himſelfe hee ſcrapeth vnto ſides vvell ſhall thinke wee muſt haue eye ſayde heere true wee ſhall foorthwith perceiue howe oure lorde doth cure ſpake making reſtore thing haue ſo ſwallowed vp deuoured let v behold thing word wee conceiue ſelues ſee euidently make v wee ſhall tempted doe euill maketh v ſo couetous take away mennes goodes bycauſe wee beare ſelues hande thoſe thing ſhall continue v euer contrarie ſide ſee howe god threatneth v intente ſhould ſerue brydle reſtreyne v might tempted ſtretch handes men good inrich ſelues loſſe neyghbours nowe immediatly ſayde euill bee ſweete mouth hold see heere trim fit ſimilitude sophar vſeth expreſſeth poynt deſpyzers god wit looke take pleaſure looke finde ſweeteneſſe holde themſelues feede humour example couetous man gather good ſuger honnie surely man hunger ſtaruen although piece maet nother taſtable ſauerie yet wil chop vp commeth paſſe salomon ſaith prouerbes throughly hungred thinkes meate hee eateth bee ſweete although bee bitter deede wicked ſame cace ſay miſdooings finde ſome ſweeteneſſe howe come paſſe bycauſe diuell ſauceth looke vpon whoremaiſter chafed owne luſt diuell blindeth make finde ſinne ſo ſweete delight man giuen drunkenneſſe gluttonie hee ſerues ſame ſauce thus yee ſee howe wicked deſpyzers god doe finde ſweeteneſſe miſdooings playe theſe liquerous folke licke lippes holde ſuger yea ſomtimes keepe vp roofe mouth hold ſweetneſſe longer loth ſwallowe downe ſoone vve ſhall ſee ſome theſe liquerous ſort another bodie ſaith could finde hart haue crane neck intent fauour meate might tarie longer meete cup good wine thinke haue neuer emptied glaſſe ynough would faine haue ſweetneſſe tarrie longer ſpring runne continually sophar ſayth wicked doe find fauor iniquitie like theſe liquerous folk whē haue delicate morſell mouth holde vpon tong rub palate licke lip well eaſe lo point wicked end find bitternede hidden vnder commeth man giue one poyſon muſt ſeaſon honny ſuger bitterneſſe felt firſt taſt aſſoone poyſon ſwallowed worketh verie ſharply bitterneſſe becommeth much feercer deadlyer hee felte firſt receiuing morſell yet mouth alſo wicked haue ſwallowed downe ſaide ſweetneſſe sophar ſayth ſhall turned gall adder nowe muſt wee indeuer beare mynde ſurely although declaration ſimilitude euery man ſees meetly common doctrin ſuch one may vnderſtood euē rudeſt vnlearneddeſt ſort yet notwithſtanding colde practizing doth always ſhew haue takē heed inough neuertheleſſe ſuche grace ſimilitude man may well ſee holye ghoſt ſet downe end ſtirre v remember conteyned wee perceiue diuell commeth tempt v layes baytes v let v beware allured vice wil firſt ſight haue alwayes ſome ſweetneſſe ſo wee ſhall bee deceiued bee full hooke hungrie fiſſhes ſooner byte bayte immediately bee ſtricken hang faſte hooke euen ſo v ſuffer ſelues bee ſeduced beguiled oure owne vice yea euen heathen men haue often vſed ſimilitude according plato ſayth looke howe many luſtes affection men ſo many baytes allurement satan offereth throw headlong afterwarde deſtruction true beginning bee ſome likelyhoode ſweetneſſe ſeeme bee ſweeteſt thing world ende conteyned muſt needes ſhewe ſelfe wit ſweeteneſſe wicked ſhall haue felte miſdoings ſhall turned gall adder much heere mention made deſpyzers god wit aſſoone ſhall haue chawed poyſon ſwallowed downe although feele bitterneſſe firſt yet muſt ſhew ſelfe end let v pray god ſuffer v finde ſauor vice giue v ſpirit wiſdom wee may diſcerne aright deceiued vaine ſweeteneſſe wee feele finnes fyrſt taſte let v allured rather let v ſeeke true liuely ſweeteneſſe grace whiche communicated vnto v sauiour ieſus chriſte ende may fill v ſweeteneſſe hope euerlaſting life wherevnto calleth v furthermore let greeue v though bee kept hungrie life haue wherewith fill ſelues rather bee pyned god hande many affliction miſeries let greeue v ſay beare aſſuring ſelues ſhall bee partaker heauenly inheritaunce wher ſhal haue full frition ineſtimable ſweetneſſe god hath promiſed thoſe yet hidden v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledging ſinnes praying ſuffer v yeld ſelues satan deceit although owne nature ready turne aſidevnto enticementes offereth v yet may ſo hilde backe reſtreyned holie ſpirite none luſtes affection fleſhe may carrie v away toſſe turmoyle v wont may ſtedfaſtly withſtand thē vntill power holie ſpirit wee haue gotten full victorie bee come marke good god hath ſet afore v beeing conformed glorie vnited ſonne heauenly kingdome wee may haue wherefore glorifie magnifie reioyce fully may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c lxxv sermon third vpon xx chapter sermon goeth ſtill expoſition xv verſe text following 16 ſhall ſucke venim adder toung viper ſhall ſlea 17 ſhall ſee riuers ſtreames flovve vvith honnye butter 18 ſhall reſtore vvhich hee hath gotten ſhall tarie vvith according ſureneſſe chaunge nother ſhall inioy 19 hee hath gathered togither hee ſhall bee made poore hee hath ſpoyled houſe builded 20 ſhall feele contentation belly nother ſhall able keepe deſire among corruption intice v drawe god giue ſelues euill dooing one men ſimplie perſuaded deſirable thing bee rich without regarding wherein rich conſiſt ende poſſeſsing enioy world blind ſo knoweth rich end purpoſe men ſhould rich ſo wee ſee wretched vnbeleeuers wedded affection namely man muſt riche meanes ſoeuer herevpon fall ſnatching polling extorcion paſsing come thing ſo haue meane knowe god curſeth haue gathered greate abundance goodes ſo may ſeeme haue ſwallowed vp whole earth ſhall reape fruition goodes poſſeſſe god plucke goodes handes elſe make ſo melte away ſhall feele profyte much doth ſtande v hande marke well ſentence conteyned heere firſt ſhewed v men guyle ſelues beare ſelues hande haue gathered great good ſhall inioy yet notwithſtanding thing couetous folke doe ground vpon may get land poſſeſsions ſay ſhall take reuenewes ſo ſhall neede goe ſeeke corne wine myne owne cellar garner ſhall haue make money beſides againe ſhall haue diuers thing ſo men ſhall bee fayne ſeeke mee ſhall haue neede none ſhall bee honored ſhall credited man hang groyne mee ſhall haue money pouch wring nowe men make ſuch account may ſoone come ſhort reckening common prouerb ſayth recken without hoſte god may well ſuffer ſuch men gather gain heape vp great ſtore bee fullie fraughted charged muſte lay vp ſtomaks againe thus ye ſee ment firſt place ſaying hath deuoured greate goodes hee must ſpue vp againe god plucke bellie come paſſe vnbeleuers beare themſelues hand good haue gotten ſhall continue alwayes ſhall neuer bereft bycauſe perceyue god heauen muſt cal account ſhewed v ſtreine rightly ſayde couetous folke make iuſt reckening ſure goodes poſſeſſe holy ghoſt bringeth v backe iudgement god vvhen man ſayth hee ſhall haue ſwallowed vp good owner ſo hath coffer garner cellar alſo belly god able plucke againe let v aſſure ſelues purpoſe haue deuoured getting good behoueth v aboue al thing able proteſt truly hold god ſay haue gotten mean lawfull allowed god ſo hath put thē hand lo principal point muſt ame meane euē whē cace ſtādeth vpō gathering good world let v ſo foliſh imagin al happineſſe conſiſteth rich rather let v bethink ourſelues true richneſſe hauing great abundance worldly good gottē right wrong bliſsing god ſo mā cō tented hath therwithal alſo able inioy vſe good handes ſpeciall gift god furthermore let v afraide threate god make v ſpue vp wee haue deuoured notwithſtanding ſtomacke bellie haue conſumed let v learne ſay take god giueth v grace bee contented ſo play cormorant drunkard cram ſo much faine lay vp byandby rather ſober aduiſed man taketh repaſt meaſurably ſo let euery v take heed increace himſelfe ſuch meanes god giueth caried away ſo exceſsiue couetouſnes deceyue one ſide deuoure rake deceyte one way pill poll another way therfore ſayde let v content ourſelues receyue whatſoeuer god ſhall giue v added yet greater curſedneſſe wit ſuch lyke inriche themſelues ſuttleties crueltie vnlawfull meanes doe ſucke poyſon adder viper toung ſhall kill according afore wit wicked mennes meate ſhall bee turned intoo gall adder within bowelles notwithſtanding find ſomwhat ſweete mouth yea licke lippes delight themſelues rolling toung vve ſee ſuch neuer thinke themſelues haue inough well eaſe merrie may deceyue man againe haue practize hande ô ſay fall well purpoſe ſo take hande get thing neuer bee reſte till haue brought thus ſweeteneſſe tong god turneth bitterneſſe vvherefore let v marke well ſayde heere wicked ſhall ſucke poyſon adder viper ſhal kil thē ſhewe v god well chaunge ſweetneſſe wicked doe beguile themſelues intrap folke thinke themſelues happieſt men worlde bee ſhort paradyſe intrap men ſides muſt goe ende ſayd god chaunge turne thing adder poyſon thought bee ſweete honnie ſuger let v ſimply followe petition wherein lorde ieſus chriſte hath taught v aske dayly breade god vnder ſaying comprehended god ſhall haue giuen v eate drinke muſt alſo voutſafe turne ſame good nurriſhment ynough v haue wherevpon feede lorde muſt alſo fayne bliſſe • throughly make auayle nurriſhment ſhall ſee againe anon hee crammeth glutteth ſelfe much eating ſo farre ſuffized ſhall bee turned bane true may well filled ſhall maner wretched bodie hath dropſie dropſiman purged humor bodie ſhuld bee better eaſe one half cup wine one bit bread would good meate world foraſmuchas full naughtie humor within might drinke vp sea fiſſhes men ſay yet neuer better euen ſo haue deuoured al thing cruelly like wild beaſtes god muſt fayne turne bane ſo folowing admonition moyſes let v learne pray god foſterfather euen therfore god feede people wilderneſſe ſpace fortie yeeres without bread vitayles giuing manna heauen god ſayeth hath mainteyned thee ſort intent thou ſhouldeſt know time come man liueth owne labour ſo thou mighteſt ſay diligence mine owne hand haue gottē theſe thing like thou ſeeſt god fed 〈…〉 father wilderneſſe māna heauen ſo giueth thee bread receyue thou owne hand nowe let v go couetriches rake ſelues therewithall let v marke ſayd wit ſhall ſo farre turning welfare god conuerteth adder poyſon maketh like byting scorpion yea might know experience although written let v open eye ſhall perceyue god executeth iudgements worlde ſame maner ſpecified blind ſay vtterly ignorant ſhet eye bicauſe would ſee true ſomtime cannot diſcerned euen good men troubled much feare yet god ſetteth markes vpon iudgements end might receyue ſome inſtruction therefore long v wilfulneſſe bee ſeene bycauſe wee turne away ſight god ſheweth v let v learne bee ſomewhat wizer whereas told v heere ſhall come ſo farre ſhort nurriſhed good get rauening ſame ſhall become bane ſhall ſooner burſt v ſatisfie v let v learne content ſelues little god ſhall giue v ſo ſame may v good ſayd immediatly wicked ſhall ſee riuers ſtreames flow butter honnie heere wee done vnderſtand wicked ſhall bee depriued bliſsing god hath promiſed ſpecially faithfull whiche giue ſuch abundance riuers flowed wine honnie butter true ſee yet wee bee ſuſteined god grace know reſt vpō goodneſſe fatherly loue aſſuring ſelues careth v nurriſh v child riuers flowed full honnie butter ſhould ſo well contented wee thing world may periſh fade away ſauing fountaine wit hand god neuer drieth without cauſe ſayd heere precyſely ſuch feele ſayd nurriſhment god play wilde beaſtes may well burſt themſelues haue pit welſprings worlde yea great riuers yet muſt • thirſt middes abundance ſhal able ſuffize cauſe deſtitute god bliſsing ſaid wherein conſiſteth reſt contentation men meane fill ſatisfie ſay make ſay ho may prayſe god alwaies go forewarde race haue bliſsing god good world cannot ſuffize v theſe ſayings common ynough ſhould ſeeme yet fully perſwaded true ſo ſurely ſhould ſee equitie vprightneſſe reigne among mē ſhould neede ſo many lawes ſo many iuſticers repreſſe extortion committed yea ſhould neede ſo much teaching exhorting euery man would bee owne ſchoolemaiſter teacher euery man would carie iuſtice inclozed hart ſo ſhould needefull come iudge ſhould neede seriants aduocats proceſſes would preuent miſcheef aſſure ſelues god hath put good world hand could ſuſteine v thought good hath promiſed v although one graine corne one drop water good ſooth wee conuinced hereof experience crauing ordinarie foode hād fed like little babe goodneſſe haue much yet let v content ſelues ſheweth v grace nurriſh v manna fell vpon v heauen wee haue much haue v put right vſe whiche wee muſt bee cormorant keepe euery v himſelf wee haue receiued muſt communicate ſuch haue want neede ſeing lord auoucheth himſelfe foſterfather thoſe let v feare ſhall left deſtitute knoweth needefull v let v hold ſelues contented ſo faire promiſe certainly diſcretion v euery one v would refrayned ſhould neede threatnings lawes ſay abſtaine ye euildoing hurt neighbour man wrōg others ye would haue done ſelues euery man would brideled himſelfe induced vprightneſſe would go violence wee ſeene men luſts ſo outrageous cannot meanes bee tamed cord cheines able tie ſay ſhoulde neede ſuch conſtreints handes would owne accord bee tied vp euill yea would deſirous ſerue euery man turne good theſe cauſes wee ought minde leſſon well ynough draw v backe vanitie looceneſſe exceſsiue luſts wrong extortion haue bin wont enriching ſelues moreouer ſtirre v vp regard god reſting vpon onely bliſsing therewithall vſe well goodes hee hath put v truſt knowing wee bee ſtewards giuing v vpon condition wee ſhould yeeld good faithfull account ſhewing none v hath deuoured alone himſelfe made neighbour partaker according abilitie wee haue receiued thus yee ſee effect conteined ſaide wicked ſhall reſtore whiche haue gotten ſhall abide verely according meaſure change nother ſhall inioy wee haue herd heretofore expreſſed heere full wicked neuer ſatisfied although haue gathered ſo much goodes ſeeme ready burſt vvherfore alwaies want bicauſe lord proſpereth thing haue hand like man might caſt much goodes gulfe yet ſhould ſeene ſo inſatiable man may ſnatch catch ſides yet ceaſſe hungrie ſtil commeth twoo cauſes ſingular grace god wee content ſelues little ſo call vpon name waite fed hande according haue found ſelues haue bin nurriſhed heretofore ſo contrarie part ſuffereth couetouſneſſe vnbeleeuers bee kindled ſo bee alwaies gathering euermore coueting neuer contented ſame puniſhment let v marke well firſt cauſe wicked cannot inioy great goodes haue gathered bicauſe lorde ſets luſts fire ſuffereth haue racke within neuer ceaſſeth torment deuill ſtill kindleth fire god iuſte permiſsion harte regard thus muche concerning firſte point ſecond cauſe like god increaceth one graine corne nurriſhing thoſe maketh multiplie hundred ſo little ſhall ſuffiſe make fat likewiſe contrarie part curſeth withereth euer wicked cram ſhall eate dubble ſay ſhall gather ynough much howbeit god conſume euery whit ſayd prophete ſhall go naught ſo greate heape goodes ſhall vaniſh away minute houre yee ſee god rooteth vp whiche men made greate account cauſe wicked cannot enioy whiche poſſeſſe true bee proude ynough according alſo lord ieſus chriſt ſheweth parable riche man inlarged barnes ſoule ſaith merrie haſte thou well wherewith feede thee beholde thou haſte ſuche abundance thou canſt neuer wante thoſe therefore ſo wedded worldly goodes haue gotten muche wicked dealing haue great cauſe boaſt rich withoute cauſe ſayd vnto rich flow vnto ſet hart vppon thereby prophete meeneth hardly ſhall men bee riche ſhall find themſelues wrapped worldly vanity alſo cauſe saint paule exhorteth timothie warne rich men worlde bee exalted pride vvhereby doth v wit riche men make ydoll goodes ſo thinke themſelues bee aboue ſtate men vtterly forget themſelues wicked may well reioyce getting manner reioycing curſed one euen ſuch one god muſte end turne gnaſhing teeth anguiſh therfore let v marke muſt ſtand vpon day yeere wee ſee wicked triumph take pleaſure ſtate beare themſelues hand felicitie let v looke end wee ſhall find thing conteined heere ſhall accompliſhed ſay ioy euerlaſting howſoeuer world goe wicked alwaies torment vnquietneſſe ſurely could ſee theyr hart would appeere euen middes ioyes alwaies full care perplexitie afraide leaſt earth ſhould faile looke vpon man hath gathered great goodes ſurely man ſhall able beare pride hee could find harte ſet foote vpon men throtes vnder colour credite trāples one vnder feete oppreſſeth another make third honour god home owne houſe ſtands tooting vpon himſelfe peacocke owne tayle ſeene ſay yet hath ſecrete pricking within god abide ſuche glory manner goodes ſhould haue certaine reſt putteth woorme gnaweth ſuch wiſe continuall anguiſh perplexitie howſoeuer worlde go ſaide expreſſely heere wicked ſhall make restitution according lengthening chaunge ſaying may firſt bluſh ſeeme ſomwhat darke conteineth good leſſon effect ſheweth v wicked muſt faine reſtore thing haue gotten greate labour firſt point hee ſhould ſay men blinde witleſſe take ſo greate peines get goodes muſt yeeld vp though haue neuer ſo much hard nippe wee knowe couetouſe ſorte wedded goodes man ſhoulde breake bone plucke maree goodes poſſeſſe deere owne liues farre led away cō ſider goodes created men vſe income preſent life yet notwithſtanding wee ſee wicked torment themſelues haue neuer ſo little harme loſſe goeth harte thē man cut throte hundred time yet neuertheleſſe muſt faine reſtore good bicauſe god plucketh hath bene ſaide heeretofore yea euen according prolonging chaunges rechaunges haue made ſo god haue turne change alſo howe vvhen man ſo gripple gathering goodes god giueth head doo ſo tranſpoſe thing may ſeeme hee make newe world hee impoueriſheth rich abateth much pulleth downe aloft lo couetouſe much lieth doo make new worlde god ſaid giues leaue time plow vp thing men ſeeming yea venim poyſon ſtuffe themſelues full vomit vp agayne anone yea feele horrible bitterneſſe whiche haue ſwallowed downe haue ſo changed thing ſay haue made ſuch turning haue land poſſeſsions none cofers filled wheras three ſhillings purſe eſtimation credite whereas deſpized afore haue changed whole world god alſo hath turne mortall man preſume diſplace thing hee practize determine would ſay ſhall god chaunge length vvill ſit idle heauen thinke theſe chaunges made heere without permiſsion ſuffereth done thinke wee hath reſigned office meddles gouernement world bicauſe winketh thing time blinde wicked ſorte ſuffereth compaſſe enterpriſes intent caſt downe deadlier fall otherſide exerciſeth faith pacience faithfull might troubled ſight ſuche change haue diſcretion wait quietly end ouerſhoote thēſelues haſtily whereby god trieth faith meanes prouoked returne god greater earneſtneſſe ſo ſayd wee ſee heere conteyned good leſſon mention made pride wicked ſort making chaunges ſo ſeemeth woulde ſpite god diſplace bound god hath ſet like haue realm dominion bee bounded ſo alſo haue bound ſettled amōg priuate perſons euery one may peaſably poſſeſſe owne theſe raueners theſe gulfes theſe wilde beaſts ſhould ſeeme ſaid loth leaue either bound border thing elſe would fayne make newe world haue changed pace hath god ſuffered muſt afterward chaunge copie ſet thing againe former ſtate thus much concerning ſentence anon ſaide bicauſe wicked haue impoueriſhed good ſpoyled houſes whiche builded heere ſee behoueth v conſider god iuſtice puniſhments ſendeth worlde truely already good inſtruction wee knewe chaunges world caſuall men terme thē ſay happen alteration ſame proceedeth hande god though ſimply graunt god ſuch power ſay ruleth world doth thing nothing done guideth determination yet go glorifying god ought like god knowen almightie ſo alſo knowne bee righteouſe true hath bin declared heretofore wee ſhall alwayes perceiue ſayde righteouſneſſe thing ſeene yet muſt haue theſe two thing witte firſt muſt know thing turned fortune aduenture god diſpoſeth thing god gouerneth holdeth bridle marke one point knowe almightineſſe god wherevnto worlde ſubiect vve muſt come ſecondly righteouſneſſe ſay wee muſt fully reſolued perſwaded god turning thing world though dalied played v tennisball wicked ſorte ſay god maketh ſport men taking pleaſure either exalt men caſt downe v let v aſſure ourſelues god almightineſſe tirannical inordinate power ioyned vnſeparable bād righteouſneſſe ſo doth thing vpright maner true haue ſayde wee ſhall alwaies perceiue righteouſneſſe god ſometimes hideth cō ceiue reaſon doth thing howbeit let ſhould good reaſon thing wherein iobs friend deceiued therein wee muſt reſemble condemned iob wicked man imagined common manner god iudgements muſt eſteemed al one rate vvhy ſo ſayd afore ſometimes god doth thing v incomprehenſible vvhat ſhall cace let v conclude neuertheleſſe god righteouſe yea let v confeſſe therewithall iudgements bottomleſſe pitte cannot ſounded god two wayes commended holy scripture righteouſneſſe sometime god puniſheth men iniquity ſight world ende might bee feared honored ſayde prophet eſay god keepe court ſhew himſelf iudge world inhabitant earth learne walke vprightly whereas euery man tooke leaue afore euill thinke ala ala iudge whome wee ought feare thus yee ſee howe god righteouſeneſſe ſometimes ſhewed openly ſometimes alſo god woorketh faſhion ſtraunge v ſo wee haue inquired thing come ſo paſſe taken wee muſt bee fayne come ſhort purpoſe yet neuertheleſſe behoueth v acknowledge god righteouſe honour ſecrete iudgements whiche bottomleſſe pitte howſoeuer worlde go ſayde god muſte bee hilde alwayes righteouſe heere ſpeaketh god righteouſneſſe apparant vnto v wee may behold eye ſayd bicauſe wicked haue beggered good men themſelues muſt bee payde like meaſure bicauſe haue raked ſpoyled men houſes god muſt driue thē turne quite dores make reckening dwell eaſe wee haue good diſcretion change come amiſſe wee may profite ſelues ſorts god doo time impoueriſh ſuch haue liued wel let v aſſure ourſelues bee done greene tree ſhall become ſeare tree ſo let v tremble vnder hand god praying graunt v grace inioy goodes hath put handes intent pleaſe bereeue v let v pray giue v ſtrength beare paciently pouertie ſhall ſend vnto v thus yee ſee haue marke ſide wee ſee lord compelleth cormorant vomit ſwallowed downe making yelde account conſtreyning reſtore whiche ſnatched away driuing houſes builded violence deceit bereeuing goodes gathered lewde fetch let v acknowledge god dothe hold aſſyſes ſhew v although thē ſuffer wicked grow riche intent ſame ſhould cōtinue euer thing haue ſwooped vp ſhould turne bane whereas goodes faithfull ſhould turne welfare become good riuers flowing butter honnie ſay let v acknowledge ende wee may behold god iudgementes humble ſelues vnder alſo let v learne enuie wicked ſeeme liue reſt eaſe abundance credite honour god turne miſerie put open reproche ſhame men thus yee ſee becommeth v marke chaſtizings puniſhmēts god ſendeth vpon worlde wee may applie inſtruction saint paule counſeleth v brother ſayth lette man beguile vaine woordes truly man may heare wicked woordes caſt foorth god iudgements ſcoft deceiued ſaithe paule wrath god commeth vpon vnbeleeuer ſuche thing ſhould ſay tarrie till god ſmite vpō head puniſheth wicked eies knowe cannot away vngodlineſſe muſt bee faine ſhew himſelfe iudge abuſe pacience long therefore profite ſelues ſuch chaſtizements learne know intendeth make wiſe men harmes lo heere marke ſentence afterward inſeweth ſaying taking away bouſes builded true god promiſed people ſhould dwell houſes builded ſpeciall promiſe god ſet people lande canaan againe wee knowe howe holy scripture ſaith generally man happie whiche eateth labour owne hand nurriſhed therewith therefore intend haue goodes v good let v learne haue ſuch cace wee may ſay god hath giuen v god meddleth craft extortion confeſſe deede wicked inriched without yet therefore ſayd alloweth doings nother ment wicked acknowledge god ſay thanke god thinke ſelfe beholding hath giuen hold diuell god bliſsing therefore let v ſide learne ſaid afore make account promiſe happie eate labour hand ſay eate thing ſuch haue gotten good lawfull meanes allowed god furthermore let v aſſure ſelues purpoſe builde world thing heere fleeting tranſitorie let v like theſe fooles make neſt worlde would ſay looked neuer go therefore let v bee tied whiche chiefe houſe bodie though man haue great palace ſumptuouſe houſes world certaine cannot continue euer cannot keepe himſelfe priſon peculiareſt lodging euery man hath owne body yet wee ſee brittleneſſe vvhat firmeneſſe hath nothing corruption rottenneſſe vvhat done let v hie v heauenly building ſay let v deſire ſo repaired god ſpirite may dwell v wee bee made temple whatſoeuer corruptible tranſitorie v may renewed ſo may ſet ſame ſtate promiſed v yee ſee muſt world ſeeke draw men goodes v take pleaſure whiche none liue cōtented whatſoeuer god giueth v therewithall pray god ſo builde v may temple end may dwell v holy ſpirite ſuffer satan carrie v away enter v nurriſh vice ſinnes v meanes would make body foule ſtinking ſtables know god cannot dwell filthy place therefore wee haue ſettle v wee muſt firſt pray clenze v vncleanneſſe end may build v grace bee true temple holy ſpirite lo wee may well builded wee muſte vnderſtand proceedeth meere grace according scripture auoucheth bee charge build vp sion like generally lord ieſus chriſt buildeth whole body churche ſo alſo let v aſſure ourſelues muſt fayne builde one v thing muſt ame vve muſt wedded flightfull corruptible thing worlde muſt hie v euerlaſting thing labour till become fullie lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele may learne miſlike take ſuche hartie remorſe wee ouercome temptation hie v alwayes heauenly glory true heritage may ſo giuen vnto may ſeeke nothing pleaſe god frame ſelues wholly ſo wee may ſhewe deedes calling v vnto vaine wee willing glorifie whole life acknowledging benefites whiche hee giueth v meere grace end wee ſhould yeeld praiſe due honour may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c lxxvj sermon fourth vpon xx chapter 20 ſhall feele ſuffizance bellie nother ſhall keepe deſire 21 none meate left therefore ſhall goodes multiplied 22 vvhen abundance full ſhal anguiſh hand labouring men ſhal come vnto 23 vvhen hath vvherevvith fil bellie god ſhall ſende dread vvrath make raine vpon meate 24 vvhen fleeth yron vveapons bovve ſteele ſhall meete vvith 25 ſvvord ſhall bee dravven ſhall cut ſhall paſſe gall fearefulneſſe ſhall vpon zophar going forward matter delt yeſterday addeth wicked man neuer hath contentation reſt ſhall fare thing better aught leaueth behinde nother ſhall goodes thriue heire ſucceſſour ſentence hath bin declared alredy howbeit larger confirmation thereof repeted againe may beare better mind alſo better perſwaded ſee man haue abundance goodes opinion wanteth nothing hath contentation felicitie ſo needeth nothing elſe take pleaſure ſeeing thing anſwer hart deſire māner marke pray perceyue wretchedneſſe hid whome god curſeth giue iudgement according ſee eye god iudgement inclozed bone maree therefore yee ſee behoofe heare ſentēce often may ſurer haue remēberance printed hart ſide looke vpon rich man thinke heauen earth ſhould mingle themſelues togither confound therefore god declareth although man haue neuer ſo great welth yet ſhall ſame periſh euery whit vaniſh away ſuch wiſe ſhal nothing heire ſucceſſor hope vvherefore let v marke well theſe two point may learne ſet ſtore god bliſsing welth world tempted couet curſed rich cannot come good end bicauſe god ſcatter abrode lo whervnto leſſon ought ſerue v let v vnderſtand firſt chiefe marke muſt well prouided great abundance worldly goodes god muſt ſo ſingularly graciouſe vnto v may feele fauour wee may ſure father take nurriſhment hand giue v contentatiō reſt ſee couetouſneſſe men deſire neuer quenched theſe worldly goodes sure ſhall bleared ſometimes euen blaſts yet doth god opē eye ſuch ſo giuē gathering rich perceyue howe nothing paſſe away ſwiftly ſmoke thē impoſsible man ſhould cōtented ſatisfied looketh vpon goodes hath hāds meane haue reſt ſee haue ynough god ſhew himſelf father beleeue hath hande continually ſtretched giue v al euer haue neede vvhen haue regard v ſhall haue good reſt although one bit bread ye would ſay yet notwithſtāding aſmuch ſure god rich ynough maintaine v waite vpon whiche promiſeth ſaith lion wild beaſts notwithſtanding bee giuen rauening ſeeme though would ſwallow vp thing ceaſſe ſuffer hunger ſcarſitie wheras god nurriſheth thoſe time derth true ſhall bee alwayes exempted diſtreſſe yet god ſuccour come extremitie ſay thing wherin faithful reioyce benefyte ſpoken heere like wicked men haue true diſcerning benefite ſo childrē god eſteeme morſell bread declaration god father thereby bee alſo confirmed hath ſuſteyned thē day ſo duetie morrow likewiſe hath alwaies wherewith grace goodneſſe neuer abated cauſe ſayd goodneſſe god laid vp ſtore thē feare true thinking vpon bodily nurriſhment principall point wherby god haue v feele loue fauour beareth v wee muſte mount higher namely although wee verieſt wretch whole worlde yet hath god prepared rich v aloft heauen wherevnto wee muſte hie v therevpon wholly ſet oure mind neuertheleſſe looke whatſoeuer good god doth v bylow foretaſt giueth v ſouereine goodneſſe let v come backe againe texte wee alledged pſalme lord great abundance thy goodneſſe thou haſt laid vp ſtore feare thee vvherefore doth prophet ſpeake ſo bycauſe although god doo ſheade bountifulneſſe euery according ſayd mercie vppon creature yea euen vnto brute beaſts yet wicked vngodly notwithſtanding cram themſelues god benefit till burſt perceyue goodneſſe vtterly voyde knowledge thereof god hath layde vp ſtore thoſe feare thus muche concerning firſte poynte ſhewed v heere namely wee muſt deeme men happie great abundance goodes poſſeſſe according contentation vnpoſsible ſuche know god grace ne haue care ſhoulde haue contentation bycauſe knowe benefite haue whiche one afterwarde ſayde ſhall bee remaynder meate ſtraunge thing man ſhall haue heaped vp great goodes ſhall likely leaue child little king god vndermine ſhall bee remaynder lefte surely falleth continually nother haue ſaid god haue one vnchangeable rate kept alwayes execution iudgements worlde thing ſhould nothing reſerued till latter day yet ſhall perceyue ſome token god conſumeth ſome man goodes ſuch ſorte ſhall apparant men eye yet knowe become meanes hath bin impoueriſhed vvhen ſee ſuch thing ought wee thinke god executeth office giueth v occaſion thinke vpon acknowledge iudge intent inticed inordinate luſtes wee wont bee ſurmiſe oure happineſſe conſiſteth raking much goodes ourſelues imagine rich euerlaſting rather come alwayes backe poynt ſeeking ordinarie foode hande day morrow life long thus yee ſee ought practiſe leſſon sophar hath ſpoken manner addeth wicked man chiefe welth ſhall ceaſſe bee anguiſh handes labourer ſhall come vnto elſe hand men able doo great acte ſhall come vppon ſo ſenſe may dubble word placed betokeneth man foreward executing thing may bee taken man laboreth traueleth worketh may alſo taken man diſpoſed harme wrong violence howbeit playne meening euery labouring hand ſhall come wicked doo ſeruice yet ſame ſhall boote lo ſumme sophars meening ought beguile ourſelues wee ſee wicked throughly ſtuffed lord heapeth vp goodes houſes ſo ſhould ſeeme hee minded giue hundred time giueth men whole world ready ſeruice ſomuch haue men fee euery man offereth himſelfe vnto ſaying sir pleaſe imploy haue hand labour ſeruice profite yet ſhall ceaſſe bee anguiſh behold wonderfull iudgement god therfore ſo much ought bee ſenſible v ſay ought touched ſo much thing againſt nature man hath wherewith himſelfe good ſo wanteth nothing yea liſt haue great trayne may haue great number take paine might liue eaſe pleaſure ſhould able inioy owne goodes liue continuall griefe afrayd leaſt earth ſhould faile surely thing againſt reaſon neuertheleſſe ſee welynough god dothe perſecute ſorte bicauſe haue gotten rich lewde practiſes thereby ſhewing right well geere ſerue thē purpoſe bicauſe curſeth euery whit behold ſay iudgement god right ſtraunge ſo wee ſeeke commeth paſſe ſhall finde meane therefore conclude god whiche worketh ſo againe ſeemeth v wee haue good willes loue men ſo euery man ſeeke v ſeruice goeth well v wee neuer want ſaide heere wicked haue men ſorte commaundement ſo haue whole hoſt men ready labour profite nothing worth continuall anguiſh heere therefore zophar intended inlarge ſayd afore ſay hee intended giue v greater certeintie god iuſtice vppon wicked thereof ſetteth v wealth good men beare thus yee ſee riche men ruffle ſeeme v owner god hath yee would ſay power anoy see men ſotte themſelues owne imagination ſhall abundance boote nothing wee ſee wicked continuall anguiſh although haue wherewith make themſelues merrie neede ſay word table ready furniſhed haue ſeruants commaundement haue retayners fee ſhort ſeemeth world created none yet cannot eate one morſell bread eaſe poore man doth worth paſt valew fiue ſhillings betaketh himſelfe god ſuch laboring man liueth dayly vpon dayes worke hath dined knoweth wherwith ſhall ſuppe referreth god aſſuring himſelfe leaſtwiſe hee good cace bird lift vp billes heauen god feedeth ſay poore folke cace yong rauens according ſayd pſalme god nurriſheth bliſsing vve ſee vvherefore let v learne turne againe vnto god aſſuring ſelues wee ſhall want thing take charge v though giue v great abundance goodes bliſsing ſhall ſuffiſe v ſay let v aduiſe ſelues ſorrowfull though god ſo beneficiall v wee would haue although hee deale ſparingly v yet lette v ceaſſe haue franke hart ſhort let v martyr ſelues meaſure vpon truſt neuer faile v token vnthankfulneſſe men god ſhall haue ſhewed himſelfe liberall towards giuing great abundance goodes yet notwithſtanding ſtill doubtful neuer ceaſſe thoughtfull muzing vppon one thing ſay token neuer acquainted god grace elſe knewe haue eſteemed ought god giue v wherewith let v learne content ſelues knowing ſetteth goodneſſe eies intent ſhould learne ſettle ſelues vpon reſt alſo one point namely although wee haue wante worldly goodes likely many euils miſeries ſhall come vpon v yet muſt withſtand ſuch thoughtfull conceit true wee cannot vtterly careleſſe nother muſt wee yet muſt moderate paſsions ſpecially muſt conſider fed god hand ſo wee may ſeeke foode alſo hang vppon goodneſſe without greeuing ſelues much vvhen men fauourable v lette v acknowledge god dothe comforte yet muſt wee reſte ſtill vppon men god curſe labour ſuch wiſe ſhall riſe early go late bedde yet ſpeede neuer better neede wee god bliſsing though wee bee deſtitute helpe onely grace bee ynough v contrariwiſe wee may haue whole worlde ſide yet god reach v hande certaine ſhall go backward thus yee ſee ſhewed v ſentence wee could practize wee profited oure lyfe long piteouſe cace euery v ſhall haue confeſſed theſe thing wee ſufficiently conuinced wee cannot ſettle ſelues vppon ſo wee well ſhew effect beleeue none thing god bliſsing dothe men good giueth contentation cannot haue eye vnto exerciſe v withdraw hand giue v ſuch abundance would wiſh acknowledge almightie ſuccour v yet notwithſtanding meening call v thither afflicting v ſhould giue v ſome ſtrokes ſpurre prouoke v ſeeke deſire pitie v ſeeming neuer haue ſuſtenance ynough except haue abundance hand nother conſider pleaſe god deale ſparely v bliſsing ſuffice v better welth worlde lette v paſſe ſayde wicked ſhall haue filled bellie god ſende terroure wrath ſhall rayne vpon meate confirmation haue ſeene erewhiles true zophar paſſeth ſayde wicked ſhall liue anguiſh although bee throughly furniſhed ſtored thing yet ſhall ceaſſe bee incombered bycauſe god giueth contentation rather ſtings ſecret pricking ſomuch fayne martyr themſelues continually yea although men indeuer themſelues ſerue yet ſhall sophar hath ſayde ſo hee addeth may well bee wicked ſhall feele god curſe firſt ſtroke ſhall welter yea boaſt themſelues good fortune tearme bee ſhort yee ſhall ſee wicked men liue ſuch eaſe outwarde appeerance ſhoulde ſeeme feele god wrath beholde ſaith sophar turning hand god make rayne vpon meate ſhall rayne rage wrathe vvee ſee haue touched already whiche heere higher ſtep whiche haue expounded already anguiſh whereof mention hath bene made vnquietneſſe comberance wicked haue ſpringeth continuall diſtruſt haue regard god world nothing truſt vnto therefore greate vexation mind neuertheleſſe ſayd ſhall eaſe time ſhall dazled ſo owne ſeeming ſhall bee happie reſpects vvell doth therefore follow god bliſſing vpon god ſuffereth wicked runne riot ſo put truſt ſort rich doo prouoke god know wealth commeth therevpon take occaſion ouerſhoote themſelues ſo much thus ye ſee brutiſhe wicked become haue ſayd vnquietneſſe pricke reſt contente themſelues weening goeth well ſo muche muſt god vengeaunce increace vvhy ſo bycauſe haue gotten goodes amiſſe bycauſe haue craft extortion bycauſe beſtow naughtily bicauſe ſuccour ſuche haue neede rather gulfes moreouer bee ſo vnthankefull proude againſt god ſhoulde ſeeme would worke ſpite bee ſo greatly bound though beholding thing preſume vpon rich make paradiſe world thinke thēſelues peereleſſe make horne doſſe againſt god beholde pray top iniquitie whiche cauſeth god vengeance bee horrible vppon head sophars intent ſay friend although yee ſee wicked vtterly beſotted welth bee opinion harme light vppon yet let v thinke cace better euen ſhall thinke vpon nothing making good cheere worlde loue god ſend fire wrath whiche ſhall fall vppon tempeſt raine commeth ſuddainely sommertime little blaſt woulde ſerue man turne beholde commeth ſuddaine ſtorme vnthought euen ſo likewiſe god wrathe ſhall bee ſuddayne hee liſteth puniſhe men ſo yee ſee none ſhifte v ſhroude ſelues vnder ſhadow god goodneſſe ſafetie whither giue v abundance whither deale ſparingly v vvhen wee bee vnder hande protection one bit bread good v nurriſhment manna heauen wee haue abundance wee ſhall perceiue therein god ſheweth himſelfe father v handdleth v child faythfull therefore euery way fare better thing god ſendeth wicked may well haue wherewith burſt yet muſte god throwe downe turne goodes harme vvee ſee fell people iſraell contented heauenly manna vnſauerie thing longing meates bin accuſtomed egypt vvell god ſent meate ſuch quantitie caſt vp agayne meate yet throtes ſayde pſalme wrath god came vpon thus yee ſee god ſtealeth vpon men vnwares euen twinckling eye vpon thē thinke themſelues ſubiect lorde giue v goodes let v learne intangle ſelues nother lette v make graue thing ought ladder v climbe higher vnbeleeuers hie god whē haue goodes ſnarle ſelues therfore make graue faſten themſelues earth withall contrariwiſe muſt make ladder goodes god giueth v world climbe vp aloft wee may led vnto knowing goodneſſe fatherly loue apply benefit ſuch vſe meeneth v vvhat done though wee haue meate drinke yet neuertheleſſe let v lifte vp eye aloft deſire god feede v wee muſt throughly perſwaded meate take ſuſtenaunce onely power god maynteyneth v agayne meate may periſhe although mouthes elſe ſhall turned gall poyſon belly full fed let v thanke god hauing care v continuing fauour towarde v meane lette v bee prouoked ſerue thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſentence zophar addeth wicked man fleeth yron weapon ſhall meete bow ſteele vvhereby ſignifyeth god hath many wayes perſecute puniſhe wicked ſo ſhall bee able ſcape hande ſhiftes attemptes ſoeuer make truly wicked alwayes ſeeking ſhunne inconueniences bring bold ynough deſpize thing zophar alſo meant bewray preſumption ſayde wicked ſhall ſhunne yron weapon hee ſayd true wicked ware wiſe ynough ſeeming eſchue inconueniences aſſoone foreſee inconuenience ſtreightwayes muſt remedied ſuch order ſuch muſt taken wicked therefore ſhall ſo faſt aſleepe ſhall alwayes haue eye ordering theyr affaire turne vnto god intend take order make recourſe receyue counſell holy ſpirite hee may bring enterpriſes good ende nothing pride ſtatelineſſe ſomuche thinke ſhall welynough finde good conuenient ſhiftes owne braynes agayne know howe belongeth god guide thing leade doings end marke wicked yeld honour vnto god conſult beate braynes prophet eſay ſaith make diſcourſes conclude beare themſelues hande go thing bring paſſe themſelues haue deuiſed god ſheweth ſhall fall cleane contrarie attempt bycauſe haue bene ſo caried away owne fond fancy let v marke well wicked neuer ſo ſuttle ſeeme alſo eaſie find ſtartingholes reaſon haue laid ſo well affayres aforehand yet notwithſtanding god find ende ſhall able ſcape nettes effect thing ſhewed v god hath diuers meanes perſecute enimies earthly prince hath made great preparation preuailes diſappoynted hope new begin againe without remouing without deuiſing thing hee needes ſpeake word bring pafſe army worlde vve ſee hath incountered enimies diuerſe time rayſe great hoſte men puniſhed pharao egiptians ſent woormes filthyneſſe beholde god woorketh pleaſeth agayne ſuffer wicked ſcape ſome harme foloweth policie haue ouercome god hande againſt lord ſuffereth end condemnation ſhoulde growe greater ſhould waxe wilfull opinion according alſo wee ſee come paſſe wicked eſcape ſome aduerſitie vnouerwhelmed ſhake eares quite diſpatched ſurmize therevpon take greater libertie afterwarde god doth ſend ſome ſmall aduerſitie wicked purſueth greate rigoure let go eſcaped ſcotfree dubble anone ſo much ſcoffe god pacience prouoke anger alſo muſt fayne vtter roughneſſe thunder vpon whereas ſcarce giuen ticke rod muſt bee faine draw ſword againſt take bow ſhoote therefore let v learne minde ſaying well aforehand ende lorde viſit v may thinke ſhunne miſchiefe owne byleapes rather commit ourſelues vnto ſted perſocuting v deadly enimies deſerue may voutſafe take v mercie cauſe threatnings repeted ſo often holy scripture heere onely ſayd wicked man ſhall flee weapon yron meete bow ſteele ſee lord himſelfe ſpeaketh prophet ſaying ſhall ſmall purpoſe thee hide thy ſelfe thine houſe thou go feelds thou ſhalt meete wilde beaſts thou art eſcaped mouth lion ſhall bee beare ſhall find thee welynough heereby lord ſheweth hath creature hande ſerue owne turne perſecute men ſo wee cannot make account diſcharged till wee haue found fauoure ſight haue pitie v onely meane ſure ſafe god haue receiued v flee aloofe frō hath long hand hee hath drawne ſworde hath bow alſo ſay hath ſo many ſortes chaſtizings puniſhmens ende wee muſt needes fall vnhappily except reconciled vnto haue ſhewed alredy nowe like god threatneth ſwords bowes wild beaſts scorpion ſuch lift vp themſelues againſt ſtoutly harden themſelues againſt hand ſo alſo contrarie parte hee ſheweth hee hath wayes without number ſaue thoſe flee refuge goodneſſe put theyr truſt therein true wee ſhall inuironed many miſeries many deathes ſhall lie wayte v god alſo hath diuerſe wayes ſuccoure v yea v incomprehenſible therefore wee vnprouided meanes ſo ſhall ſeeme v vndone let v bethinke ſelues thus god hath ſome iſſue death knowne himſelfe ſame hidden v bycauſe intendeth exerciſe fayth let v tarrie till diſcouer goodneſſe ſhall pleaſe make countenance ſhine vpon v ſhall perceiue life euen midds death ye ſee threatnings god maketh wicked ought make v reſort vnto ſo ſhall wee haue full matter gladneſſe reſt notwithſtanding wee many daungers aſſoone wee bee paſſed one another hand ſeemeth v neuer deliuered like god hath ſwords puniſh wicked ſo hath infinite deliuerances ſuccoure faithfull one lo effect wee haue remember verſe concluſion ſaid ſword ſhall drawen pearce gall fearefulneſſe ſhalbe vpon vvhen hee ſaith ſworde ſhall bee drawne pearce wicked quite cleane gall muche ſay ſhall bee deadly ſtroke ſhall wounde harte ſerueth v vnderſtande god puniſhementes ſhall ſometimes bee ſuddayne true alwayes ſo therefore muſt made generall rule alſo haue tolde queſtion whither god perfourme iudgements ſwiftly yet doth hee giue v ſome ſhewe euen life ende wee ſhould earneſtlier herken laſt day whereas thing ſhall bee ſet agayne full ſtate perfection neuertheleſſe ſaide god iudgementes ſhall ſometime bee ſuddaine zophar ment expreſſe ſaying ſword drawen ſhall ſtrike quite gall hee ſhoulde ſay wicked man ſhall perceiue farre god mindeth puniſh hee ſhall keepe trace ſtill danger beit ſword ſhall ſooner bee drawen ſcabbard ſhall ſtrike body wee ſee meening ſentence heereby bee warned foreſee daungers good aforehand end wee may flee vnto god pray keepe v heere god iudgementes ſhewed v bee ſuddaine alſo ſaide wicked ſhall ſay peace ſafe god wrath ſhall fall like thunder vpon head heereby ſaid warned looke great way v inconueniences may happen whereunto life ſubiect vvere corzie life ſay miſerable much better v god put v world wold teach v fall aſleepe world runne vnto god aſſure ourſelues vphild power oure god wee may outeface satan world yea death ſelfe bycauſe wee ſhall haue god protector defender ſo let v marke well whereas wicked perceiue owne miſerie throw downe rather foraſmuch mind call vpon god contrariwiſe beare themſelues hande haue neede deſtruction muſt needes fall vpon thinke furthermore hee ſaith immediatly fearefulneſſe terroure ſhall go inch thus wicked haue dubble miſchiefe whiche ſworde ſhall runne ſoone drawen ſcabbard beſides god ſhall neuer ſuffer bee reſt although daunger paſt yet ſhal tremble feare ſtill whereat euen ſhaking leafe tree ſaide ſhall thinke death hath already caught man purſueth thē ſee wherat holy ghoſtamed firſt intended ſhewe v wee muſt enuie wicked bee ſo well garded may ſeeme harme come neere thē god ſhal ſtrike turning hand yea euen deadly ſtroke whereof may neuer healed marke one point another ſee wicked feare wee muſt vnderſtand one meane reſt know vnder god protection therefore let ſuffice v although behoue v walke feare yet ſhall wee alwayes bee ſure goodneſſe whereas wicked deſpiſers maieſtie ſhall alwayes ſo afraid ſhall neuer haue reſt therefore let v learne retire god lowlineſſe liue neighbour withoute man wrong leaſt ſame meaſure bee moten v againe wee go ſo worke ſurely god make v feele goodneſſe deliuer v danger terrours diſmayings happē v nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele bee ſorie conſider better iudgements hee ſheweth v wee may dayly bee inſtructed withdrawe ſelues tranſitorie thinges thys world whiche wont blind men though felicitie conſiſted rather wee may atteine wiſedome skill knowe god draweth v trouble wee ſee heere bylow pleaſe exerciſe v affliction wee may thinke prouoke v ſeeke ſide handle v gētly end feeling fatherly loue ſhuld ſticke faſter loue honor ſo muche earneſter minde ſtill paſsing heere bylow inioying benefit beſtoweth vpon v vntill bring v true happineſſe whiche tarrieth v heauen may pleaſe graunt grace c lxxvij sermon fifth vpon twentith chapter 26 darkneſſe ſhall laid vp ſecret place fire blowen ſhall conſume curſed ſhall reſidue houſe 27 heauens ſhall bewray iniquitie earth ſhall riſe vp againſt 28 blud ſhall go houſe flowing water day wrath 29 portion wicked man god heritage hee ſhall haue god word ſaw yeſterday howe deſpiſers god afraide without comfort true godly may bee abaſhed afraide god comforteth runne vnto ſure ſuccoure wicked inaſmuche deſpiſed al men ſo full pride thought themſelues ſubiect miſchance god ſcare ſuch ſorte ſhall bee remedie feare therefore let v learne ſtand awe may walke godlily let v learne well aduiſed careleſſe murtherers ſhall finde god make v ſafe euē middes terrours thus remedie afraid meaſure walke warely ſo know infirmity v daū gers compaſſe v ſides wee may pray god voutſafe reach v hāde diſtruſting ourſelues learning ſettle ourſelues wholly vpon alone vvhen haue ſuch kinde feare god glad v neede ſhall ſure helpe play hardie ſtout fellowes muſt god needes bring v confuſion ſhall conceiue ſuch feare ſhal good hel already world expreſſe better wicked ſhall find meanes ſafetie sophar addeth theyr priuie ſecrete place ſhall bee darkneſſe hidden layde vp firſte ſight ſemeth great matter ſaying throughly vnderſtoode appeere bee good confirmation whiche ſaide long ſince heere priuye place meant backenookes whiche wicked haue god perſecuteth according haue alwayes ſome lurkingholes hide themſelues vvee ſee howe wicked man alwayes haue ſome blinde byway play foxe digge himſelfe denne many ſtartingholes may bee taken vnwares although know wellynough god entereth place yet beare himſelfe hand ſome little hole hee may hyde himſelfe ſo god hande may come sophar ſaith euen ſhall finde darkneſſe ſay although wicked indeuer ſhrinke themſelues ſhrowdes yet notwithſtanding god purſueth ſhall haue ſuch terrour within thē ſhall quake although man follow ſhort meeneth whyle deſpizers god farre blowes ſet light threatnings beare themſelues hande none euill may come neere commeth verie pinche beſtirre themſelues get couert though god lay hande ſhewe euident ſigne hee agaynſt yet ſhall haue darkeneſſe ſay ſhall haue vnquietneſſe teacheth v ſeeke blinde bywayes ſhunne god hand let v vnderſtand oft god citeth v himſelf wee muſte come foorth account therefore let v deuiſe ſhiftes eſcape yea although worlde ſeeme promiſe v neuer ſo many lurkingholes let v aſſure ſelues nothing vvherefore let v come willingly vnto god offer vp ſelues maieſtie praying receyue v mercie face ſhine vpon v ſhall wee bee deliuered ſet free darkeneſſe yea althoughe whole worlde confounded put order yet ſhoulde wee alwayes bee ſafe ſure cuſtodie god otherwiſe wee couerts worlde ſhould ſo little auayle v ſhoulde finde diſmayedneſſe wee diſcouered ſydes coulde ſee miſerie vpon v afore hande yet notwithſtanding men cannot refrayne themſelues ſeeking lurkingholes bee ſeene contrarie part intendeth god hee ſendeth v worde hee would haue bee creſſet yea rather sunne v euery v might ſerche himſelfe ſo ſinnes vnknowne v may bee layde open v euerie v bee ſorie furthermore eſpie puniſhments wee haue deſerued ſo wee may bee taken vnwares like vnbeleeuers whiche behight themſelues peace ſafetie maye diſcouer god iudgements wee high watchtower ſayde prophete abacucke preuent inconuenience towardes v ſay preuent euen prayer ſupplication repentance yee ſee wherat god ameth hee inlightneth v goſpell wee drawe quite backe aſmuch v lyeth wee quench ſayde light bycauſe wee bee naught loth thing whiche hidden v ſhoulde come light bee ſhort wee couet alwayes bee flattered doth v pleaſure abuſe ſelues ſuch flattery god doo worde hath borne ſway v vvill hee ſit ſtill accompliſheth whiche hee ſpeaketh prophete sophonie wit hee entreth lanterne euen deepeſt caues beholde hee ſayth citie ieruſalem viſite thee lanterne ſayth thou haſt hidden thy treaſures priuie place thou ſhalt win nothing thou muſt needes winnowed let v ſuffer god inlighten v worde let v ſeeke lurkingholes wee bee come willingly ſort ſurely hyde v tent scripture ſpeaketh hee onely giue v houſe chamber drawe intoo alſo himſelfe wil inuincible fortreſſe v ſhort ſhadowe wing wilbe good ſafetie v contrarie part ſhall feele ſayd wit ſuch hide themſelues ſpecially dig deepe dennes ſayde place prophete eſay ſhall bee found god ſpyte teeth though owne conſcience purſue yet ſhall perceyue haue gayned nothing imagining eſcape god hande thus ye ſee haue marke ſentence conſequently ſayd fyre whiche blowne ſhall conſume heere zophar threatneth deſpizers god wicked although happē harme vnto creature yet ſhal miſſe cōſumed god wrath needeth ſayth artificiall fire wrath god ynough deſtroy willingly ſubmit themſelues ſimilitude common ynough al holy scripture namely god conſuming fire men ſtubble wil ſoone conſumed elſe ſnow melteth expreſſely ſayd god wrath fire onely melt ſnow burne ſtubble alſo cliue rockes mountaynes make whole worlde fall downe ſo neyther heauen earth ſhall ſtand vnſhaken aſſoone god giueth ſigne wrath ſhall poore creature thē ſo frayle nothing v ſtubble ſhall becom v god ſhall haue kindled fire conſumeth thing nowe wee ſee sophars meening holy ghoſt ſpeaketh mouth telleth v wee muſt truſt fauour worlde thing fall would haue yet therfore ſcaped god hand addeth afterwarde ſhall neither heauen earth ſhall riſe vp execute vengeance true ſhewe mightie incomprehenſible power hee may well nowe ſuffer creature bee fauourable towards v deſires bee fulfilled ſo nothing ſhall fall agaynſt v bee ſo eaſe god needes ſhewe himſelf enimie fire wrath ynough conſume v without ſeruice men without imploying creature allthough holy scripture make v perceyue better terrible god wrath ought v doo ſometimes ſay brimſtone thunder mingled yet notwithſtanding addeth likewiſe ſame commeth man hande made inferiour art meane wrought god according ſayd eſay hell fire prepared long ago wicked enimies god mention made fire brimſtone ſayd verie breath god bloweth vvhich al one zophar ſaith heere namely needeth bellowes elſewhere forraine helpe kindle preſent fire bycauſe force proceedeth god mouth ynough conſume wicked vtterly vttereth ſelf agaynſt let v learne frame ſelues ſuche wiſe vnto god wee may feele execution ſentence vpon ſelues late crie ala god ſhall haue kindled inquenchable fire ſayd god word ought bee vnto v burning fire howbeit conſume v clenze away droſſe ſuperfluities v like golde ſiluer fined paſsing fornace ere ſeruice applyed vſe euen ſo lorde intendeth ridde v wicked luſtes worde whiche thing onely ſuperfluous alſo hurtfull wee may dedicate ſelues afterward ſeruice muſt bee doone thing therefore god purpoſeth enflame v loue end may wholy rauiſhed therewith ſame muſt bee done meane worde wee cannot abide muſt needes become chaffe ſtubble according ſayde prophete shall woorde bee conſuming fire hammer breaketh ſtones ſhall people bee chaffe thus yee ſee howe wee cannot disfeate god worde office giueth vnto conſuming fire muſt alwayes ſo ſide diligent offring oure ſelues vnto god purge v filth wee ſhall reformed rightuouſneſſe inflamed loue contrariwiſe play wilde coltes maliciouſly ſtubburnely reiect god woorde let v bee ſure ſpyte teeth doo beſt woorſt wee ſame ſhall burne v vp euen bycauſe wee ſhall bee ſtrawe chaffe ſtubble whiche conſumed hande yea god hathe made v perceyne oure damnation woorde hee doubtleſſe alſo put hande make v vnderſtande experience hee hath ſayde vayne fire ſhall conſume wicked yea euen without blowing without kindling without putting man hande without ayde creature meane ſhort let v learne ſtande awe god wrath fall ſleepe wee ſee thing fall wee would wiſhe worlde ſerue v purpoſe iniquitie ſhall come account god hee ſhewe himſelfe bee oure iudge thus ye ſee wee haue beare away ſentence ſayde immediately reſidue houſe ſhall go hauocke ſhalt nothing misfortune vpon reſt houſe like oure lorde vttereth goodneſſe towardes thoſe bliſſing houſehold child belongeth contrarie part hee ſheweth howe dreadfull wrath ſpreading ſelfe vpon aboute vngodly according wee ſee howe worlde generally defyled v cauſe neyther heauē earth corner worlde god wrath curſſe ſeene vpon creature ſinfulneſſe vve know ſayd one man vpō earth dooth good v compriſed generall condemnation ſinne vniuerſally v foraſmuch god owne nature hateth ſinne muſt needes odious vnto ſeeing creature accurſed reaſon filthineſſe vncleanneſſe highe lowe muſt bee
