fayne feele defiling euen ſo ſtandeth cace peculiarly wicked man bee giuen vngraciouſneſſe ſo hee deſpizer god ruſhing forth euill euer toucheth defyled filth onely bycauſe naughtie man marreth peruerteth thoſe cō uerſant companie bringeth vp child lewdly diſordereth wife alſo bycauſe ſecrete curſſe god vpon head ſpread vpon child houſeholde cattell euer hath thus ſee effect mention made remnant wicked men houſes ſhewe v lorde agaynſt men haue good cauſe abaſhed ſunken deſtroyed owne perſons vengeance god muſt ſtretche yet ad nthis ſayd end wee ſhoulde enuie proſperitie wicked ſee thē farewell conſidering ende ſuch wee ſee heere therefore faythfull haue conceyued terrible god wrath muſt ſo touched muſt thinke wicked happy flightfull proſperitie doe drawe line till come vtter deſtruction ſo conclude better v ſeeme miſerable ſobeeit ſtande god fauour haue man wiſhe meane time god agaynſt v lo wee haue marke ſentence nowe zophar hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth heauens ſhall bewray iniquitie earth rize vp agaynſt hee ſayde heeretofore fire ſhould conſume wicked without blowing ſay god without vſing ſeruice creature able deſtroy th lift vp themſelues agaynſt telleth v another kinde puniſhment whiche god arme creature execute vengeance agaynſt wicked ye ſee god worketh diuerſe ſortes hee mindeth puniſhe deſpyzers maieſtie sometimes haue ſayd ſuffereth thing goe well outward appearance ſo ſhall doubt miſtruſt thing whiche ſhall ſport wallow good fortune bee drunken ſorte proſperitie beholde god ouerwhelme ſodenly naturall fire ſecrete incomprehenſible power yet notwithſtanding meane whyle bee ſayde oure lorde hath creature owne hande arme ſuche wiſe agaynſt v euerie ſhall bee ſwordes bowes arrowes weapon whiche god ſtirre vp deſtroy v withall made purpoſely bycauſe wicked bee puffed vp pride thinke get mayſtrie hardhartedneſſe bee ſeene theſe ſhameleſſe folkes bee rebuked ſinnes yea euen notorious ſinnes whiche little child bee iudges yet keepe ſtill brazen face man ſhall neuer outface till bee conuinced thrice tentymes tolde vvell maner doth god bring reaſon ende euen arming heauens agaynſt ſaye diſcouering ſhamefulneſſe meanes ſhall haue vſed ſuche vnſhamefaſtneſſe ſcoffed warning giuen yea made ſcorne god threatnings muſte bee ſo perſecuted yea euen without putting mannes hande god alone purſueth ſhall knowe become chafe vpon brydle ſpyte god withall furie ouerpaſt muſte bee rooted ſhameleſſe ſtubburnneſſe haue abuſed god pacience ouerlong thus ye ſee effect zophar mente ſay haue wee doo true ſometymes wee ſhall bee wrongfully diffamed oppreſſed falſe ſlaunders wee maye commend cace vntoo god hee make oure rightuouſneſſe ſhine bright morning scripture ſayth inſomuche night paſſed wee haue ſome darke ſtorme hath ſuppreſſed knowledge oure innocencie god ende ſhewe himſelfe bee warrant maynteyne cace ſpyte wicked lye contrarie part wee go woorke wyles thinke ſcape oure ſhiftes hypocriſies let v looke whiche ſpoken heere namely heauens ſhall bewraye iniquitie ſpite teeth wee muſt come open light diſcouered midday vvee bee oure lurkingholes verie well god ſuffer v bee little hee skill well ynough hale v oute oure deepeſt dungeon bewray oure ſhamefulneſſe vvhether wee wee muſte bee aſhamed ſhrowding ſinnes whiche ſhall ſteppe vp agaynſt v yea creature notwithſtanding tyme haue ſeemed neyther heauen earth whiche fauoured v god become oure enimie creature muſt needes ſhewe themſelues bee ſubiect vntoo true happeneth alwayes oute hande according haue declared heeretofore god iudgements executed diuerſly yet muſte wee alwayes haue ſaying oure eye witte heauens ſhall bewraye iniquitie ſuche deſpize god earth ſhall ryſe vp agaynſt ende wee may learne diſcouer owne iniquity vntoo god scripture counſelleth v doo let v oure owne free accorde acknowledge dettes confeſſe ſelues blameworthy god haue wee ſo diſcloſed oure owne iniquitie dooth god couer dooth hee burie dooth caſt intoo bottom sea ſo ſhall neuer come remembrance agayne haue wee ſhewed bothe heauen earth oure onely deſire god ſhould pitie v bycauſe hee might good right condemne v beholde heauens ſhall bee mantle v earth ſhall likewiſe couer v ſo oure iniquity ſhall buried ſay wee muſte confeſſe oure iniquity vntoo heauen ſay god wee muſt alſo confeſſe earth wee ſhall haue caſt ſtumblingblockes churche haue liued amiſſe muſt bee aſhamed yelde ſelues guiltie men haue ſorrowed god wee minde ſhift thing lying god muſt fayne ſhew hathe ſpoken ſentence vayne zophar hath ſpoken ſo bee addeth bud houſe ſhall go away like flowing water day god wrath mention made heere budde houſe wicked men expreſſe hope haue time come ſhall beguile wicked cropped god hande hope ſtill bud agayne renue recouer former ſtate ſayd god diſappoynt budding make ſlide away water day wrath true faythfull ſmitten god hande alwayes releeue themſelues hope miſerie ſhall indure euer according promiſed thē god wrath indureth turning hand mercie ſhall laſt towardes euer faythfull may ought well comfort themſelues bycauſe know god make ſpring agayne holy scripture vſeth often ſimilitude although cropped yettheir roote left ſtill grounde nowe take ſuch hope preſume vpon owne power intent ſpite god haue acknowledged worthie forſaken god truſte hee haue mercie vpon infirmity contrariwiſe wicked hope afflictiōs ſhall continue euer maner defying god kinde iuſtling agaynſt knowe hardeſt beholde god agaynſt ſide ſticke tackling ſay ſo wilfully bent vntoo ſturdineſſe determine neuer bow neckes continue alwayes ſtiffe agaynſt god therevpon flatter themſelues beleeue miſerie whiche endure ſhall paſſe away bee gone ſhall go well wherevpon commeth take ſuch hart grace ſayde afore haue truſt god mercie proceedeth diueliſhe pride ſo beare themſelues hande god hande ſtrong ynough daunt reaſon whereof wil wiſe ſubmit themſelues vntoo therefore behoueth v marke well conteyned ſentence god make budding fade away like water ſay ſhall purpoſe wicked take highly vpon beare themſelues hande ſhall bee ſette vp againe god plucke vp roote rinde although haue ſome bud left ſay although god haue left ſome little ſhewe ſo might ſeeme vtterly diſpatched yet ſhall fade away ſpecially day wrath muſt wey ſaying dothe v vnderſtande wee muſt notimagin god ydle ouerpaſſeth thing putteth hand puniſhing wicked hee hathe conuenient ſeaſons hathe god wrath certaine determinate day whiche wee know therefore wee ſee wicked proſperitie triumphes ſeemeth misfortune ſhall euer befall let come oure remembrance wrath god hath day god knoweth time puniſhe ſay let v tarie paciently meane learne heereby fall aſleepe god ſpare v lorde make v feele vengeance time let v alone handle v gently although wee haue offended ſay let v flatter oure ſelues therefore daungerous deceyte men ſleepe ſaping ſinnes thinke vpon god wrath vnder colour beareth gather great heape wrath themſelues saint paule ſayeth ſecond chapter romanes let v learne flatter ſelues ſuche time wee bee reſt let v dayly thinke vpon daye god wrathe preuent namely trembling continually oure iudge praying receyue v mercie bycauſe ſo greatly indetted vnto let v keepe mouthes ſhet commeth mainteyning cace zophar applyed matter rightly hee condemned iob hee acknowledged iob whiche hee ſpeaketh generally wit whereas wicked doo proſper yet notwithſtanding iob hauing led blameleſſe life puniſhed ſo rigorouſly ſayd god diſalloweth alloweth wicked hee hathe day wrath true zophar prophet god yet dothe hee peruert thing balaam bycauſe hee diſcerneth fitte time goddes wrath whereof hee ſpake cauſe ought wee giue better heede ſaying ende wee haue ſayde skill ſpake namely conſider god hath couuenient tymes puniſhe wicked conclude doctrine wee haue heard hee ſayth ende portion wicked yea god hand god hand alſo heritage like bycauſe wordes touching concluſion ſealing haue heard heere intent might authoritie harte might fully aſſured receyue without doubting marke portion wicked whoſe hande god ſayde true wicked rufſle worlde play looce colt beleeue iudge heauen neyther thinke vpon yet cannot pluck preheminence maieſtie hee prepareth indytement ſerueth expreſſely daunt wicked put god minde much alſo good leſſon faythfull teache ſay go wee may muche euill ſhall bee pardoned men handes yea ſhall neuer ſay ſo muche blacke eye end wee muſt come iudge come thither forbearing men hand turne double condemnation counſell haue gather text name god expreſſed heere two time men oftentimes diſcharge dutie ſpecially thoſe meene office vve neuer paſſe admoniſhing ſuch amiſſe correcting winke yea magiſtrate whiche ought put hande repreſſe offence doth verie often let alone men bothe generally particularly diſſemble make countenance ſee whitte god negligent office well haue beene borne thoſe haue borne muſt come accoūt name god togither circumſtance text ought wey greatly v ſith know without cauſe ſaid ſuche portion wicked yea euen godsbāde ſerueth wipe away theſe vaine hope whiche woont conceyue men giue v hande eyther winke ſinnes elſe pardon let v truſt vpon bee double confuſion v afore god let v aſſure ſelues although ſcaped worlde yet muſt god ſhew himſelfe iudge whereas mention made portion heritage alſo ſerueth v vnderſtande muſt fully reſolued poynt god leaue wicked vnpuniſhed like euerie man calleth thing portion ordeyned alotted vnto hathe lorde alreadie aſſigned wicked whiche belongeth vnto heritage ſay ſame theyr patrimonie ſo nothing peculiarly man owne puniſhment god lay vpon wicked hee ſpeaketh purpoſely woordes howe ſo true ſome men reſtreyne blaſphemies wicked belke agaynſt god worde ſette downe heere ſoundeth none euill muſt taken ſimply witte wicked men may well alledge many excuſes liſt ſhall gaine nothing ſhall bee condemned wordes surely zophar eye iob therein ſayde afore applied amiſſe vnto yet ceaſſeth true good ſelfe holy ghoſte pronounceth heere generall wicked gay woordes ſhall rooted hande god therfore worde couched heere without cauſe ſee continually wicked deſirous pleade agaynſt god thinking worke wonder vntoward allegatiōs truly god ſuffereth hold plea ſo time length hee ſheweth whiche written geneſis namely ſpirite ſhall ſtriue longer man god borne outrageous wickedneſſe could bee ſawe men abuſed pacience maner ſayde longer pleade muſt fayne put hande thus ye ſee ſayde heere wicked may well file tongue iuſtify themſelues good skill chop logicke god ſhall cace rather ſharpē ſword god muſt bee fayne execute ſorer iuſtice terribler vengeance vpon heades men may armed tongue pleade agaynſt god god hath hande armed ſtretch heauen confounde ſuche ſhall ſo pleade agaynſt ſaying ought touche wicked doth heereby ſeene brutiſhe blockiſhneſſe greater parte worlde noweadayes bowing vnder woorde god vnder correction done vnto v name authoritie men encounter ſuch ſturdineſſe well bee perceyued religion among among turkes paynim onely warning vayne giuen men ſecret alſo open fault ſpoken pulpit whereas men ought aske god mercie ſue humbleneſſe bee ſeene men fully bent ſtande ſtoutly agaynſte god example ſpake laſt sunday ſhamefull outrage beene doone heereby cologny fell iuſtifying themſelues conſpyring agaynſt god deuiſing themſelues howe hide thing altogither apparant matter sermon broken church yet coulde obteyned thoſe royſters handes leaue warned matter complayned howe thing bee ſuffered men ſeeke meanes coloure yea ſome picke quarell great wrong doone vnto yee wretched men yee ſhoulde haue prepared youre ſelues lordes ſupper tolde ſhamefull diſorder intent ye ſhoulde bee ſorie leaſtwiſe ye beene become deuils ye ſhould haue beene ſomewhat touched conforme ſelues come cleane contrariwiſe rage woorke miſcheefe apparant heereby ſeeke nothing fight openly agaynſt god wee ſpeake ſecreter matter yet whole worlde knoweth wee ſee open whoredomes wee ſee blaſphemies wee ſee drunkenneſſe gluttonie exceſſes wee ſee deſpyſing god woorde eccleſiaſticall order wee ſee bribery cruelty muche gentleneſſe among men among woolues ſo none meening doo violence one poll another finally ſhame gone theſe thing apparant outrageous thing man ſhoulde ſpeake pulpit man might well bee wearie conſcience come receyue lordes supper hande thou commeſt euen ſame iudas thou ſhalt bee ſure feele god vengeance trembling cain thou art manifeſt apparant reprobate haue alledged example ende wee might learne ſtande checking agaynſt god hee liſt pleade v ala defence ſhall wee haue get vpper hande cace yet let v thinke god needeth ſtudie howe tell long tale hee conclude execute ſentence without pronouncing newe agayne haue ynough holy scripture wherein hee ſheweth himſelfe iudge whole worlde thus ye ſee haue marke text wit wee confeſſe faultes afore god wee ſhall forgiuen hande wee ſtande pleading wee ſeeke lurkingholes hyde oure iniquity wee ſhall conuinced worde alſo hee lay ſo rough hand vpon v ſhall ouerwhelmed vnder yea euen without remedie bee time aske forgiueneſſe therefore let v take conuenient time god aſsigneth v offereth v meane obteyne mercie goſpell nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele may leade v true repentance ſteede hardning oure ſelues may bee ſo hartbroken yea euen hee make v feele ſoreneſſe wrath euery one v maybe owne iudge ende wee ſhall appeare iudgement ſeate lorde ieſus chriſt oure ſinnes maye bee couered buryed rightuouſneſſe ſo let v ſay almightie god oure heauenly father c lxxvij sermon first vpon xxj chapter iob anſvvered ſayde 2 heare vvordes let comfortes 3 beare vvith vvill ſpeake vvhen haue ſpoken mocke 4 talking vnto man vvere ſo hovv ſhould ſpirit faint 5 marke abaſhed lay hande vpon mouth 6 verely vvhen bethinke afrayde feare taketh holde fleſh ſeemeth ſort woordes whiche iob ſetteth downe heere contrarie worde god inaſmuche hee auoucheth god puniſheth notthe wicked letteth alone ſo proſper wee haue ſeene heretofore wee muſt conſider iudgements god executeth worlde according recorde holy scripture firſt ſight talke iobs ſeemeth vtterly repugnant truth muſt remember hath ſayde heeretofore namely holy scripture ſpeaketh god iudgements ſayeth hee accompliſheth peremptorily ſomtimes taketh hande ſhew himſelfe iudge worlde poynts caces yet one rate therfore ought ſuffize v god giueth v ſome token wicked cannot ſcape hande muſt come account neuertheleſſe god doth ſometimes diſſemble ſee experience behoueth v acknowledge god dothe prouidence gouerne worlde maynteyne preſerue good puniſhe wicked wee make generall rule ſuche bee wicked puniſhed hande god delayeth puniſhment till afterward vſeth ſufferance reſerueth thing life come thē ſhould enter great diſorder vvherfore ſith knowing god iudgements ought ſuch wiſe wayt accompliſhment fulfilling latter day thereby wee maye well diſpatche contrarietie ſeemeth firſt bluſh betweene iobs ſaying heere holy scripture vvhat iob meeneth wee ſee wicked proſper god ſo farre puniſhing bee caried ſtill pleaſures delightes euen till dying day ſo pine away long lingring rather ſeeme bee exempted priuiledge god hande aduerſitie nowe ſeemeth ſort iob intended beare men hande thing gouerned fortune god hathe regarde worldly matter ne careth meening nothing ſo according alſo himſelfe proteſteth ende intent men ſhould take offence woordes vvhat purpoſe ſhew god viſiteth man wee muſt firſt daſhe giue ſentence condemnation vppon ſay ſuch one wicked man ſuche one hated forſaken god behoueth v examine well life wee muſt thinke god doothe alwayes handle men worlde wholly according deſerts vvherefore ſee wee ſo many wicked men ſpared ſhoulde ſeeme iniquity knowne god ſeing layeth puniſhment vpon let v vnderſtand lorde reſerueth many puniſhments latter day whiche ſeene yet agayne hee handleth thoſe rigorouſly loueth haue offended ſo greeuouſly men thing doth ſinnes ſake wee knowe doth let v humble ſelues god muſt bee glorifyed workes although wee knowe reaſon yet nowe wee ſee iob pretended bee wee may better profite ſelues conteyned heere let v lay foorth ſerche thing order hee ſetteth downe hearken mee ſayth hee take beede woordes let bee comfort ſay let bee ſteede comforte come giue mee truely wee knowe iobs freendes came ende howebeit ſore combered ſawe plight according man reaſon concluded iob caſtaway see howe dazeled generall ſentence god puniſheth wicked ſo ſet iob rancke wickeddeſt ſort thing ought doo therefore hee telleth whereas come comfort hee deſireth nothing pacience quiet hearing afterwarde proteſteth agayne hee ſhapeth talke vnto men theſe hypocrite ſeeke bee iuſtified worlde alwayes ſhunning preſence god neuer come acknowledge bee force till men haue throughly tried iob ſayth talking vnto men ſay led vayne ambition make fayre countenaunces flouriſhings men hee ſhapeth himſelfe god proofe ſayth might ſpirit holde reſpect vntoo men yee ſee ſuche neceſsitie creature able indure ſo miſerable ſtate likelihoode could haue beene diſpatched hundred tymes ere ſith ſee neuerthelater ſpirite fayleth mee ſigne knowe hande god ſubmit ſelfe reſt vpon seeing heere wauering reede yee perceyue haue better ſurer foundation forſomuche ſee ſpeake god heare mee afterwarde hee addeth thinke without feeling beholde ſelfe cannot ſore abaſhed greatly diſmayde thing whiche ſee ſurely iob ſpectacle terribleneſſe wee reade happened vnto heares ought ſtande vp vpon oure heade ſaying hee cannot thinke vpon himſelfe remember great miſeries befalne terrible feare muſt catche holde therefore ye knowe ſtate throughly ſayth bee aſtoniſhed lay hande vpon mouth ſay blame mee yee haue done hithertoo yee imagine mee pleaſure ſigne yee haue pitie compaſsion great miſerie perſone heere haue marke firſt wee comfort miſerable aduerſitie behoueth v conſider well howe required ſingular diſcretion behalfe wee haue ſeene heeretofore affliction diſeaſes phiſition vſe one medicine diſeaſes thing bee diſeaſe whote ſome colde ſome diſeaſe requireth man ſhoulde bee kept drie ſome hee ſhoulde bee refreſhed moyſture one diſeaſe haue man kepte cloſe another haue go abrode yee ſee phiſition ſhall kill patientes hee haue regarde diſeaſes yea behooueth alſo acquainted complexion patient euen ſo ought wee conſider thoſe whome god viſiteth affliction firſt muſt marke perſones howe wee ſee diſpozed ſay wee muſte marke perſonnes man haue liued without ſtayne walking feare god ſhewing token ſounde meening thing condemne wee ſee aduerſity agayne though man committed foule offence time beene rage agaynſte god hee bee daunted aduerſities hee indureth ſo wee perceyue nothing true repentance beaſtly wicked crueltie ſteppe neuertheleſſe vſe great roughneſſe agaynſt nay wee muſt rather reache hande ſuche beaten downe helpe vp according ſayde duetie teache faythfully name god ſtrengthen weake knee feeble hand herten comfort thoſe deſtreſſe anguiſhe minde yee ſee wee ought vſe great diſcretion comforting ſuche afflicted therefore without cauſe iob telleth freendes muche better holde peace increaſe trouble ſpeaking hee woulde take theyr ſilence comfort yea hee addeth haue heard hee giue leaue mocke hee meeneth might haue reaſon ſo doo rebuketh raſhneſſe according ſayde prouerbially haſtie iudge giueth ſwift ſentence ouer haſtie condemning iob hearde ſo ſayth may mocke haue heard ſpeake meeneth nothing diſorder raſhneſſe deſcant vpon vnknowne matter whereof yet throughly informed therefore wee haue common doctrine marke ſentence whiche brydle ſelues come iudging bee ſo heddie till wee knowe verie truthe indeede ſo muche ought wee minde bycauſe wee ſee men nature ouermuche inclyned raſhneſſe ouerhaſtineſſe although wee woulde fayne eſteemed bee ripe ſettled iudgement yet verie fewe bee found giue themſelues bee ſo yea worſe ſhall ſee great number make haſte ſhewe fine witte feare leaſt men ſhoulde take dullardes cauſeth v oftentimes throwe oure ſelues headlong intoo ouerhardineſſe iudge crookedly vntowardly oure neighbour without reaſon without indifferencie seeing maladie ſo naturall v let v learne examine thing wee ſpeake ſayde wize man alwayes heare foole haue mouth open neuer leaue babbling naught salomon ſayeth ſo wee well skill ſay ſo meane wee doo yll put vre therefore oure cheefe wiſedome saint iames ſheweth v ſayeth ought bee ſlowe ſpeake willing ſuffer ſelues bee taught wee haue modeſtie refrayne haſtie ſpeaking god giue v grace knowe matter wee knowe wee ſhall tell howe ſtande woord wee ſhall haue profited greatly haue learned refrayne haſtie iudgement wee cannot iudge oure neighbour ſort aduenture without double deſpiſing god goodneſſe vvhy ſo wee muſt appeare iudgement ſeate saint paule telleth v iudge neighbour knowe howe cace ſtandeth take vpon authoritie god chalenge ſelfe belongeth angell heauen ouerboldeneſſe true knowe euill ſay knowe owne imagination verie truth may bee bolde condemné ſhall raſh ſo vvhy iudge onely ratifie iudgement god hath giuen worde wee bee ſo haſtie ſpoken afore high treaſon god bycauſe rob right peculiar himſelfe pull owne perſons againe beſides offende god taking vpon v iudge ſecret matter behoueth v knowe owne meaſure haue neede inquire thing knowe ſay ſo ſo vntill wee bee throughly informed matter thoſe twoo reaſons ought holde v well awe ouerhardie iudging neighbour furthermore behoue v keepe modeſtie towarde men perſones muſt wee god doctrine pray euerie man ſtootes foorth bolt vpon doctrine haue throughly examined ſuch raſhneſſe woorthie bee double condemned haue ſhewed alreadie bee traytours god robbing honour wee iudge perſones brother knowe throughly certaine god doctrine muche precious mennes perſones go aboute infrindge ſome doctrine aduenture yea euen ſome doctrine holye scripture ſome article fayth vnhallowing holy thing neuertheleſſe wee ſee men bolde ouerbolde cace nowadayes ſhall bee ſooner beleeued matter doctrine drunkardes looce liuers heatheniſh men whiche muche skill god ſecretes brute beaſtes yea verie swine theſe muſte ſnuffe vp theyr groyne agaynſt god doctrine diſpute might maine agaynſt truth hath beene well ſtabliſhed holy scripture maketh ſo bolde euen bycauſe vouchſafe heere god puniſheth preſumption ſhewing bee ranke fooles alwayes haue tongue walking neuer haue eares open heare pacience much behoueth v practize thys ſentence admonition giuen v heere euerie one v muſt learne bee ſlowe iudge wee ſo wee ſhall bee teachable hee neuer proue good maiſter hath bene good ſcholler man worke mayſtries firſt day hee haue euer beene bounde prentice occupation hee ſhall make fayre woorke aduauntage himſelfe greatly nowe cace ſtande ſo handie craftes thought god doctrine ſurmounteth man vnderſtanding reuerenced euen angel ſo wee muſt onely haue beene ſcholers may bee mayſters wee muſt alſo perſeuer life long profiting vnderſtanding wee mynde teache others vvhen god hath giuen man grace teache others hee muſt thinke hee himſelfe bounde learne let v aſſure ſelues man ſhal euer good faithfull teacher except hee indeuer learne ſtill well men bee ſhort behoueth v well thoſe teache thoſe learne god ſcholers proceede learning yea euen till die thus much concerning ſentence nowe let v come proteſtation iob maketh talking ſayth vnto men ſo howe ſhoulde ſpirite fayle heere iob ſheweth child god ought ſpeake proteſted like alreadie heretofore beit without cauſe repeateth againe foraſmuch certain wee wander bylowe talke alwayes trayle long trayne ſuperfluities wee ſhall go matter roundly ſubſtancially wee ought vvhat cauſe wee woont ſnarle wordes ſuch wiſe man cannot wring pure truth v bicauſe haue eye vpon men beſides men bleare themſelues diſcerne thing ought ſide alreadie enclyned followe diuell alſo thruſteth himſelfe make hotchopotche thing oure woordes ſhall neuer bee well conueyed cleare except wee haue god eye ſpeake prefence ſide wee neuer throughly touched wee talke men iudge ſee wee paſſe hide vice thinke ynough euill apparant lo howe men fall aſleepe theyr ſinnes neuer ſpeake freely ought doo vnleſſe knowe god ſummoneth frameth inditements muſt preuēt tarie till god condemne rather yeeld themſelues giltie owne accorde cauſe iob proteſteth talking vnto men true ought haue regard neighbor wee talke wordes may edifie caſt forth light wandring ſpeeches ſhall lay ſtumbling blockes way may hurt diuerſe wayes therefore ſpeake men muſt bethinke ſelues afore hand ſay muſt haue regarde might bee profite yet muſt wee haue thing ſpoken heere iob put god iob meeneth ſingly deſpyzeth men hee ſee rude ignorant wiſe applie himſelfe vnto led ſuch vanitie pleaſe men onely forget god put behind rather ſpeaketh hee maketh reckening aforehande preſence god ſo thought knowne heauenly iudge therefore muſt diſguiſe himſelfe thinke cace concealing truth lo whereat iob looked ſo haue touched alredie let v haue wit pray god cal v throughly home himſelfe ſay oft hee viſeteth v handes ſo touch mindes harte quicke wee may knowe hee whiche puniſheth v oure faultes oure thought bare dazeled ſotted owne talke ſo full babling onely pleaſe men beholde ſay whereof wee bee inſtructed ſentence behoueth v remember well reaſon iob addeth ſo ſayeth wherefore doth ſpirite faynt ſeemeth hee leaueth talke heere cut ſenſe ſuch doo ſo direct talke men without regarde god ſhall quayle ende haue made fayre countenaunces firſt ſight hypocriſie bewray ſelfe laſt good footh wee ſee ſo experience ſo ledde vainglorie alwayes deſirous reputation among men onely reſpect haue ſurely tell many fayre tale roll ſo trimly rhetoricke woordes vtterly bleare men eye bee woonder heare ſpeake heerevpon ſtreake themſelues men ſooth ende god pincheth ſuche ſort hee ſheweth hypocriſie god taketh away ſtarche woman ſtarcheth hir face commeth intoo sunne heate lighteth vppon hir ſtarche falleth hir wrinckles appeare meanes whereof hir ſhame ſo manifeſt ſhee faine get hir away hide euen ſo hypocrite reaſon goodly ſhewes ſhall bee commended exceedingly worlde men thinke none euill vvell god leaueth time ſo ſhyne bright men ende hee mocketh theyr hypocriſite vtterly defaced bee pynched double treble till babling woont make layde water beholde theyr goodly rhetoricke fayleth therefore let v marke well reaſon ende may learne come vnto god owne accorde haue care ſpeake preſence conſtreyne v force violence thus reaſon ſet downe heere ought ſerue v threate make v ſhunne hypocriſie follow ſayde vnfeynedneſſe ſetling ſelues preſence god hauing eye alwayes vntoo talke wee haue eye vntoo ſurely hee giue v grace ſtande ſpecially wee followe example iob cain iudas ſuch like faine end feele god preſence moued returne repentance god brought therevntoo force let v followe iob ſay let v ſeeke holde ſelues face iudge let v go humbleneſſe acknowledging iuſtice may giue glorie belongeth deſerueth vvhen wee go ſo woorke deſire bee ſuccoured goodneſſe ſurely wittes ſhall fayle v though preſſed neuer ſo extreemely yea ſeemed bee vtterly ouerwhelmed vve ſhould ſay neuertheleſſe hilde vp ende ſo reſtored god ſhould ſhew ſuch ſeeke come hym willingly receyued hys hande yea euen bee hilde lappe hee giue ſuch reſting ſtay ſhall neuer miſcarie infirmitie neuer ſo greate nowe iob without cauſe addeth freendes looke vppon ſhall amazed compelled ſhet mouth lay hande vppon holde peace knew god iudgementes good earneſt ſurely wee woulde haue holde ſelues wee haue cauſe wee bee ſo hardie iudge ſo randon wee examine throughly thing god ſheweth v howe wee ſee manne afflicted ſurely perceyue well ynough ſame commeth god foorth wee fall raunging ſaye god puniſheth ſuche one ſinnes wherevpon fall thundering ſayde wee conſider god iudgements aright ſhould haue better ſtay oure ſelues conſyder god iudgements aright behoueth v firſt formoſt thinke vppon ſinnes perſone one man god intendeth alwayes inſtruct thouſande many looke howe manye chaſtizements aduerſities ſhewed ſo many teaching inſtructions dooth god ſende v anye man bee ſcourged wee muſt onely looke muſt alſo thinke vpon ſelues ſurely ſhall wee lift vp oure horne wee come god maieſtie wee ſhall haue ſuch reuerentneſſe wee iudge oure neighbour ſhall bee feare greefe ſhall behoue euerie one v haue iudged condemned oure ſelues aforehande haue acknowledged wee deſerue receyue muche greeuouſer condemnation handes oure god▪ wretched mortall creature ſyllie woorme earth take vpon mee iudge neighbour ſhall god doo agaynſt mee hee holdeth aſſyzes wee thought pray woulde ſtryke terrour intoo v ſyde wee ſee god iuſtice vppon manne ought wee perceyue wee ſelues haue deſerued much hee might handle v muche rygorouſly true wee coulde blame god crueltie rightuous hee puniſhe ſuch one ſo roughly ſhall hee doo mee ſay wee haue ſuch conſiderations ſerue humble v make v walke awe god onely alſo ſtrike v feare know condemnation hangeth ouer v god pitie mercie vppon v hee maketh v perceyue aboue ſee iudgements god whiche notable ſaye whiche worthie remembrance vnaccuſtomed ought touche v quicke wee ought conceyue ſo great feare abaſhe v wee dare open mouth example vvhen wee ſee common aduerſities wherevntoo wee bee inured cuſtome yet muſte wee bee ſo groſſe headed acknowledge hande god knowledge thereof bee ſtricken downe humbled feare wee ſee god ſometymes ſtretch arme ſuch ſort ſee thing wee neuer knewe thought dreadfull puniſhments howe ſtraunge neuer ſuche thing hearde suche thing ſay ſhall wee ſee behoueth v thinke yet better vpon god ſeeth v aſleepe ouerſlouthfull weakeneth v like man falne intoo ſo ſounde ſleepe hee coulde anſwere hee called yet notwithſtanding muſt needes wake hee iogged pulled harde arme euen ſo dealeth lorde v inaſmuch moued common correction ſendeth v dull retcheleſſe ſheweth v great exceſsiue puniſhments ſuch wee haue heard hee ment waken v perforce vvherefore let v bethinke v profite oure ſelues god iudgements ſimplie bee ſtriken feare bee ſo afflighted wee ſhoulde ſhunne ſtirred vp runne vntoo walke feare alſo let v deſire holde v ſtrong hande ſuffer v ſtumble ſeeing cannot bee otherwiſe v except hee holde v vp preſerue v thus ye ſee ende behoueth v bee aſtoniſhed god iudgements contrariwiſe wee ſee men ſeeke nothing forget ſeeming bee melancholike matter god ſmyte man v muſt profite oure ſelues haue declared alreadie contrarie part verie ſuppreſſe ſuch doctrine although god bende himſelfe v beate v roddes yet doo wee labour intangle myndes ſeeke vaine ſhiftes hyde god hande withall although feele ſtrypes well ynough yet wee bee acknowne howe god viſiteth v see howe woulde burie remembrance god ſtraunge iudgementes whiche ought fray men yea moue euen verie ſtones yet wee ſay ſo wicked wiſhe burie wee haue ſeene example vvhen lorde hath executed ſo terrible iudgementes mennes eares ought glowe man needes ſpeake theſe good defender honour geneua make complaint ſay man ſpeaketh • man whome god woulde haue bee horrible ſpectacle feare terrour men manne bring thing rememberance ſhewe blaſpemer ſpyted god religion ye woulde ſay ſtraught wittes inſomuch mother bare hir wombe depoſed diuell brought ſay men diſhonour citie behold theſe good men ſo zealous honour geneua coulde finde harte towne ſunken well knowne bee man needes poynt finger call name knowne well ynough yet pretende deſirouſneſſe honour citie well ſeene heart dooings proceede yee ſee howe wicked woulde fayne burie iudgementes god bycauſe bee deſirous plucke ſeate poſsible might ſubiect iuriſdiction yet hee woorketh terrible faſhion needes muſt wee bee woorſe brute beaſtes moued yet gallant would fain buried furthermore let v mark ſhewed heere wit god liftes vp mightie hande woorkes vnaccuſtomed maner waken faſt aſleepe bring v ſuch awe feare abaſſhed wee may reſort vnto learne hide ſelues vnder ſhadow pray guide v ſuffer v fall bottomleſſe pit wee haue marke text iob ſpeaketh ſtopping mouthes maner ſpeeche verie ryfe among hebrewes ſayd prophet wiſe man lay hande vpon mouth v wit thing ſhall bee ſo confuzed skilfulleſt beſt practized men ſhall knowe ſay ſhall bee vtterly paſt wittes ſo ſayeth iob nowe ſuch ſo abaſſhed muſt lay hande vpon mouth keepe ſilence iudgement god executed vppon perſone iob terrible dreadfull mannes vnderſtanding manne ſhoulde iudge fleſhe hee coulde bee amazed ſight iobs perſone nowe let v gather common doctrine god worketh ſuch maner wee acquainted wee haue glorifie ſheweth v reaſon woorkes haue knowne v putteth word mouth wee may bee able ſpeake againe ſee god workes outpaſſe vnderſtanding ſo wee knowe hee diſpoſeth thing ſo ſee done vvee muſt lay hande vpon mouth ſay muſt ſo bolde prattle vvherefore let v lerne knowe owne abilitie wee fling ſelues aſtray ouer feeldes rather follow alwayes right way heereof need knowe giuen v according alſo saint paule bringeth v ſame rule namely knowe god leadeth v vnto long reacheth v hande let v go boldely leadeth v muſt ſtoppe dumbe true muſt always haue mouth open one ſort glorifie god wee preſume bring vnder compaſſe vnderſtanding would haue reſerue nothing himſelfe whither go wee • open deſpyting god hee intendeth hyde thing v intent wee ſhoulde knowe owne ignorance yet ceaſſe acknowledge bee rightuous honour woonderfull incomprehenſible ordinance haue touched alreadie whenſoeuer god ſheweth v reaſon work let v thank goodneſſe ſay lorde thou commeſt downe verie lowe v wretched creature thou vouchſaueſt ſhewe v thou dooſt thy goodneſſe deſerueth well bee magnified v thou communicateſt ſo familiarly ſuche woorth god hyde reaſon woorkes v bee highe v reach vnto let v ſhet mouth ſay let v talkatiue babble owne fancie let v glorifie god bee aſhamed ignorant verie wiſedome faythfull knowe hath pleaſed god ſhewe therefore let v make ſilence vnto god ſort ſoeuer worke till laſt day diſcouerie bee come wee ſhall ſee face face glorie maieſtie let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſins praying make v feele better ſo caſt downe ſelues may ſeeke ſet vp may taught pitie neighbour reache hand cruell iudges ſee men aduerſitie euery one v may bethinke himſelf ende ſelues perplexitie god afflicteth v may aſſure ſelues pitie v doubt hee ſhewe himſelfe pitifull father towardes v wee returne vnto true humilitie obedience grauntvs grace holde ſelues contented hee maketh v priuie vnto nowe till hee haue gathered v himſelfe bee made like vnto glorie may pleaſe graunt grace c lxxix sermon ſecond vpon xxj chapter 7 vvhy vvicked liue grovv olde vvelter rich 8 ſeede mainteyned theyr eye vvith generation theyr preſence 9 houſe quiet vvithout feare ſcourge god vpon 10 bull commeth gendering ſeede miſſeth covve calueth barrein 11 ſende forth little one like ſheepe child daunce 12 play vpon taber harpe make merrie vvith ſounde organ ſaw yeſterday intent iob ſet ſaying firſt ſight might haue ſeemed euill god leaueth wicked vnpuniſhed ſeemeth bee agreeable office rather muche hee iudge worlde dutie redreſſe miſcheeues done beneath ought reſtreyn men ſees ſquare ſeeth himſelfe deſpized ought mainteyn owne glory pul thoſe ſo mounted vp pride rebelliouſneſſe wee ſee wicked rage againſt god abide ſeemeth thē god ſleepe therfore doth iob blaſpheme god making ſuch complaint meening ſhew ſimply although god iudge world yet foloweth chaſtizings puniſhments executeth vpon ſinnes ſhould always apparant ſo men might ſee eies point thē finger god delay iudgements behoueth v ſtay owne wiſdome ſuffer raūge abrode imagination man brayne leaſt haſtie though ſee puniſhments ſo executed wiſhed yet let v troubled offended let v quietly wayt till cōuenient time come god knoweth ſee effect iob intended howbeit intermedleth alſo tēptations faithfull may haue inaſmuch god maketh ſuch delay ſeemeth ouer •• w cannot muſt need conceiue ſome greefe weeryneſſe yet muſt reſiſtit nowe let v ſee maner iob ſpeaketh vvheefore ſaith wicked liue wherefore become old wherfore increaſe rich ſhuld ſay among al deſires men think cheef happieſt helth ſecondly haue long life thirdly haue abundance goodes theſe thing wherein men willingly place felicitie theſe found wicked cattell proſpereth offprings continueth thing fall would haue whē haue led ioyfull life go graue turning hande ſay linger pain godly droope life long full diſeaſes pulled many miſeries wicked liue eaſe ende god taketh world without great greefe reaſon whereof ſeemeth worſt ſort moſt fauored god •• cace ſhoulde thin •• god intendeth execute none puniſhments vpon wicked ſee execute firſt ſight although haue effect iob ſayth yet ſhall bee good better inlightning whole vnderſtande zophars errour true ſentences wee haue heard former chapter good true haue ſayd miſapplied bicauſe zophar ment conclude wee ſee man ſore afflicted ought ſay hee enimie god ſee man liue eaſe wee may knowe thereby god fauour god loueth muſt go ſo work verie deede errour sadduceis although sadduceis thought ſoule man bee immortall men liued worlde brute beaſts neyther heauenly life reſurrection although ſay ſo brutiſh yet thinke god men ought yeeld themſelues ſeruing walke vprightneſſe good conſcience god regardeth ſuch lead holy life ayde ſuccour ſhewe goodneſſe alſo hee puniſheth wicked geere hang togither ſeeing commonly ſuch feare god haue verie euill life world sadduceis ſay god recompenceth ſeruants worlde likewiſe puniſh thoſe deſpiſe ſo imagination men ſhoulde haue hope time come good euill euerie man ſhoulde receiue ſhould bee god well ill dealing life reſiſt ſuch imagination repreſſe ſo pernicious errour lorde ſet purpoſe doth alwayes puniſh wicked intent ſhoulde knowe another principall iudgement yet ſeene againe god doth alwayes ſhew ſignes loue beareth child hee leaueth vp ſpoyle wide worlde ſo bee martired aſſayled yet haue ſuccoure hande end might know better excellent welfare laid vp v heauen see lord ſummoneth v latter day looke howe oft wicked puniſhed haue deſerued ſpared good afflicted much beare ſeeme bee hearde▪ though call vpon god cannot bee perceyued god hath pitie vpon rather ſeemeth turne backe haue ſhaken bee minded deliuer miſerie vnder faint ſo often doth trumpet ſounde eares nowe wee ſee beaſtlineſſe sadduceis thinke men wholly mortall heauenly life good hope euill wee feare onely world yet hardned groſſe beaſtly opinion zophar companion ſort wrapped like conceyt beholde ſay god iudge worlde therefore men bee beaten roddes followeth hateth thē vtter caſtawayes concluſion fond naught vvhy ſo proceedes diueliſhe errour mennes ſoules mortall neither reſurrection kingdome god contrarywiſe theſe twoo thing may verie well agree wit god iudge world yet neuertheleſſe 〈…〉 may curſed heere life ſubiect many miſeries whereas wicked ſhall liue merily proſper tryumph haue whatſoeuer wiſh thoſe two thing ſay repugnant god iudging world appoyntment ſo hee ſhoulde faine execute iudgementes toy taketh v head god iudge world yet notwithſtanding may well diſſemble ſo whē men become froward offende meaſure ſhall neede make countenance puniſhing haue ſayd afore hee reſerueth iudgement till another time bounde ſhewe himſelfe iudge day morrow neither like men loſe occaſions dooing buſineſſes vvhen haue thing hande matter eaſie mee compaſſe take oportunitie ſlippeth away mee woulde afterwarde ſhall come tyme thereby god purpoſeth ſtirre v vp diligent enter hee openeth v gate go hee ſheweth v way himſelfe muſt ſubiect ſtate ſhould ſay worke hande oportunitie ſcape alwayes recouer tyme houre meane owne pleaſure ſo let v marke wee muſt conclude god muſt puniſh wicked life although hee bee iudge worlde ••• may conclude doth part • god iudge world therefore followeth ſeeth▪ miſdeedes done noteth ••• olleth hath care good ſuch walke feare ſeruice truſt call vpon ſuccour verie deede faythfull perceyue god neere watcheth ſafegarde know experience bicauſe addeth ſome meanes wicked alſo doo ſpyte theyr teeth feele hand perſecuteth therefore ſayd god iudgements alwayes apparant puniſheth euerie man heere meaſure deſerts god giueth ſome ſignes whereby knowne thing muſt come account men muſt paſſe hande alſo giueth ſome token ſhewe that▪ neuer forgetteth thoſe hee hath vnder protection ſafe keeping behold pray wee haue conclude holy scripture telleth v world gouerned god prouidence al thing muſt ordered haue declared alreadie woulde haue lorde ſhewe v fully perfectly nowe iudge men ſhoulde bee reſerued laſt day whole hope vvhen holy ſcripture incorageth exhorteth faythfull liue well holily ſayeth freends lift vp hart latter day impoſsible v ſticke vnto god firmly ſtedfaſtly without ſwaruing anye time except wee ouerleape thing heere beneath mount vp mind anker hold faſtened wholly muſt thus wee ſee iob incountered heere agaynſt falſe curſed opinion sadduceis thought god executed iudgements tranſitorie life ment ſhewe wicked maye well proſper haue thing woulde wiſhe yet wee muſte bee quiet though thing gouerned fortune nothing diſorder heere lowe behoueth v gather wittes togyther vntill lorde ſhewe himſelf hidden ſo long thing confoūded ſo good order wee would deſire ye ſee god doeth alwayes ſhewe countenance yet meane behoueth v ſee cleerelier naturall ſenſes example fowle weather ſee ſunne yet ſo vnwiſe wee knowe well ynough sunne ſhyneth ſtill abone cloudsif man ſhould aske little child sunne 〈…〉 quite gone would ſay hee ſo farre learned knowe light wee haue commeth sunne whatſoeuer let betwixt ſame v wee knowe experience sunne keepeth ordinarie courſe hee vp notwithſtanding cloudes take away ſight v ceaſſe ſay ſunne ſhyneth weather ſo faire calme ſee hidden alſo lorde ſendeth trouble intoo worlde wee ſee iniquitie runne abrode vnbrideled ouerflowing thing waterflud perceyue god minded withſtand rather ſeemeth let thing go hauocke ſo good men borne downe god maketh countenance ſuccour although ſigh grone ſay ſee behoueth v haue higher reach owne motherwit fully reſolued god yet ſtill aſsiſt v alſo foraſmuch ſee ſuffereth world vtterly ouerwhelmed holdeth ſtill ſecret brydle ſo reſtreyneth wicked thing paſſe bloudſhed murther let v aſſure ſelues god reigneth ſtill although darke maner againe ſee good ayded deliuered hand yet doth mainteyn preſerue without that▪ ſhould periſh firſt brunt although bee tormented aff •• ctions yet ſayde god hath quite turned backe vpon regardeth contrarywiſe euen mids darke thicke cloudes alwayes maketh feele neere hand reſcue neede therefore behoueth v bee alwayes perſuaded god guideth ſte 〈…〉 yea euen ſecrete maner thus nowe onely haue iobs meening alſo ſee vſe ende ought applie wordes gather good leſſon ſame cannot greeue v ſee thing ſo farre ſquare worlde bee tender weake hearted may againe alwayes incline euil ſide diuell prouoketh v diſtruſt ſee lord repreſſe wicked correct ſuch haue done amiſſe contrarywiſe giue releefe good ſurely may well greeue v may ſhall conceyue ſome ſorrowe hartburning demaunde god hee diſſembleth ſeeme aſleepe yet muſt haſtie boyle ſort lord knoweth well ynough ſhould execute iudgements v ſet ſchoole nowe time neuer v ſet appointment againe ſay haue wayted long let v aſſure ſelues looke feete yet another life paſſage wherein bee nowe nothing vvhen men haue liued neuer ſo long length come end way ſmall race compariſon time endleſſe life euerlaſting ſhall haue conſidered men onely created certaine time circuite make alſo god calleth thinke god ſlow although firſt daſhe execute puniſhments vpon wicked deſired haue ſhewed alredie wil ſone recouer occaſion thought haue beene loſt lo howe wee ought warre agaynſt lewde fancy come way thing bee brought ſuch order would well wiſh therefore let v learne knowe although ſeeming god worke yet tymes finiſhe worke liſteth let v tary quiet end falling ſhewe ſleepe though wee perceyued hee regarded thing • heere bylow thus ye ſee ought practize leſſon iobs whereas ſome ſay one ſide god gouerne world redreſſeth number euils committed deliuereth hee thoſe ſeeth tormented ſuch extremitie vve haue anſwere ſo exerciſe fayth pacientneſſe child aſſureth wicked vnbeleeuers vnto gentleneſſe howbeit make vnexcuſable turning goodneſſe occaſion hardening inhaunceth damnation ſo much againe bee tyme tempted wiſhe god ſhould make haſte muſt beware ſet taske true may well mourne ſay lord long yet muſt deſires requeſts ruled pacience muſt ſubiect god caces ſuffer diſpoze whole according owne vve may wiſhe yet wiſhes wee muſt thinke make god ſubiect luſtes rather thereby giue tryall obedience howſoeuer woorke thing otherwiſe wee woulde imagin beholde true practizing leſſon iobs howbeeit aboue thing let v alwayes indeuer ſtabliſhed hope laſt iudgement lo ought proceed acknowlegg god rightuous according office gouerne worlde vvhen haue lerned thoſe two point good foundation build vpon god office gouerne world muſt imagin ydoll acknowledge god incomprehenſible ſo ſay god hath maieſtie himſelf yet meane rob peculiar cānot ſeparated make idoll dead thing good ſooth gouern creature thing vnder dominion thing ordered power wiſedome pray rending peeces defacing maieſtie yes ſurely muſt bee alwayes fully reſolued point god gouerneth al thing directed guiding prouidence muſt adde yet rightuous ſo hee gouerneth diſordered faſhion vnaduyſedly neither reigning ſhew abſolute power tirants get themſelues eſtimatiō take libertie wrongfully crookedly whatſoeuer themſelues liſt god power ſuch rightly ruled rightuouſneſſe haue theſe twoo poynts muſt thence forth ſtabliſhed hope reſurrection trouble worlde vve ſee wicked liue growe olde wee ſee leade dayes mirth make greate good cheere ſee thing happen would wiſh child cattell houſehold ſo ſhould ſeeme god dandleth armes therfore muſt conclude • another iudgement ſo let v cheere vp ſelues hope comming lorde ieſus chriſt vve ſee good men vexed troubled yet heires worlde inheriting sometymes haue bit bread eate lurched cal vpon god deliuered therefore wee muſt thinke god holdeth backe ſhewing loue hee▪ beareth towardes thoſe wil yet poynts performe grace hath promiſed thē end meanes thereof might bee moued ſeeke heauenly inheritance promiſed alwayes laboring traueling thitherward thē wheras owne nature inclined ſtumbling ſtarting way wee ſee thing miſordered let ſame ſerue ſtabliſhe v let bee ſtroke spurre pricke v forward wee may drawe ſtill ſayd heauenly life ſay well lord ſee wicked haue full ſcope heere yet muſt wee enuie theri proſperitie thy curſe wayteth fall horribly vpon therefore much better v bee miſerable ſo thou keepe v mercifully meane time bee wrapped confuſion readie thoſe triumph▪ yea go lord thou haſt promiſed bee father v wee call vpon▪ thee yet ſee thy helpe firſt puſh wherby ſee well lorde place wee muſt reſt heauen heauen then▪ place thou calleſt v vnto ſo let v regard preſent life nother let greeue v bee toſſed many waues whirle wind ſith meane lord forceth v come vp vnto though ſpurred v ye ſee principall vſe wee ought put text vnto ſo iob ſo farre heere ouerſhooting himſelf hath handled cheefe article fayth ſhewing v wee muſt fight agaynſt god prouidence ſheweth ſelfe firſt daſhe follow faſhion sadducies appointing full perfectneſſe god woorkes bylow contrarywiſe alwayes haue eye laſt reſurrection bicauſe time wherin al thing ſhall bee ſet ſtate whatſoeuer confuzed ſhal put due order furthermore bee preuented temptation let v loſe courage let v returne concluſion iob maketh heere haue ſayde alreadie wee feele much experience weake bee faynt hand haue temptation pincheth v therfore thing go crookedly ouerthwartly ſo bee oppreſſed wicked haue full ſcope verely greeue v ſhall conceyue ſuch bitterneſſe hart make v enter intoo diſputation iob doeth heere ſhall wee ſurely fall intoo diſputing cannot bee wee ſhall bee troubled firſt ſight ſaye meeneth geere intendeth god doo wee muſt abyde therefore wee haue diſputed asked geere meeneth let v come holy scripture ſheweth v god kept ſo vnchaungeable order nothing might bee ſquare ſhould paradiſe bee fayth hope ſhoulde haue howbeit forſomuch lord mindeth traine v hee leaueth thing doutfull balance ſo may ſay intent ſhoulde haue eye reſurrection vvherfore let v diſcoraged although nature greatly inclined many euil temptations▪ let v lerne reſiſt let concluſion bee ſuch iob maketh heere ſay although haue bin ſhaken firſt brunt yet neuertheleſſe may conclude god rightuous doings although delay iudgements yet hee forgoeth occaſion executing liſteth forbearing wicked tarying till turne fully come thus ye ſee haue mark ſentence iob hauing alreadie ſpoken proſperitie wicked ſayth expreſſely run ſound taber flute daunce ſounde organ leade dayes mirth glad •• ſſe go downe graue twinckling eye iob meeneth expreſſe ſomewhat hee done afore ſaying wicked liue grow old thing fall woulde wiſh namely alſo part take benefite tyme beſotte themſelues good thing god ſendeth two diuers thing haue health • ſping cattell great poſſeſsions rich honour take ſuch pleaſure ſet one whole felicitie them▪ vvhy ſo abraham rich healthie ſtrong bodie iacob reporteth well ſayth owne dayes vnhappie compariſon dayes father ye ſee abraham ſtrong good lyking alſo promiſed ſhould die good luſtie old age ſatiſfied liuing bylow riche although inheritance poſſeſsions yet great houſholde much cattell ſcripture ſheweth meane beſotted bleared rich wayfarer world knew god called thing groū ded himſelfe vpon owne ſtrength like thoſe royſt play looce colt god giueth luſtineſſe health bodie alwayes man well tamed god ceaſsing humble himſelf ſo example may v verie good ſeruice worldling ſuch looke earth haue rich bodily health become ſo drunken forget themſelues regard god like ſee one table ſtayed man well ſoberly take repaſte without misbehauing himſelf another glut himſelf til burſt ſpecially ſtore wine wee ſee ſome labour nothing ſo much play verie beaſts ſeemeth themſelues throte wide ynough gulze wine ſtreyne themſelues vpon racke fill paunch better euen ſo ſome men may haue great proſperitie yet burſt exceſſe alwayes hold themſelues feare awe wicked iob ſayth abuſe god benefit gift hee doth lay brydle neckes fling ouer feeld think ſubiection inſomuch friske ſound taber flute none talk dauncing making good cheere wherat play brute beaſts altogither iob mēt vtter ſētēce wheras hee maketh v deſcription deſpyzers god ſhewing v picture end ſhould learne retyre ſuch brutiſhneſſe therefore god giueth v abundance welth let v lerne ſotte ſelues walke continually feare holding ſelues awe beeing watchfull paule ſayeth wee bee child darkneſſe god hath inlightnened v worde haue v walk high none day thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne againe god ſendeth v caſe pleaſures let v vnderſtande cutteth v morſelles bicauſe hee ſeeth bee able diet ſelues man giue childe eate hee knowes meete hee ſhall cough mee foole euen ſo doeth god deale vs▪ hath hand alwayes reached doo v good niggard expenſes though afrayde ſhould want himſelfe hee ſeeth luſts diſordered ſo rule meaſure handleth v hee himſelfe ſees beſt v giuing v conuenient portion let v knowe haue wherewith make great cheere wherewith feede pleaſures god dooing cut v pittāce knoweth ſtomack brooke abundance would marre v thus ye ſee haue marke ſeconde part ſentence ſaid wicked run ſounde taber flute neuertheleſſe wee ſee noueltie child world exceede meaſure vanity god condemneth dauncing ſuch like looceneſſe hath bin ſo time diuell whoſe drift tend blind men draw regarding god ſpirituall life hath theſe knackes time time men haue willingly folowed haue liked pleaſed fleſh therfore whereas dayes ſee many men ſeeke nothing royſt inſomuch haue none countenance ſeeking hop daunce like ſtray beaſtes doo ſuch like thing let v vnderſtande late beginning diuell hath reigned time howbeeit let v knowe alſo euill neuer bee excuzed auncientneſſe men haue alwayes done ſo yea bycauſe diuell hath alwayes reigned muſt god therfore quite diſpoſſeſſed furthermore ſhall bee declared fully morrow god leaue true flute taber ſuch like thing condemned ſimply owne nature onely reſpect men abuſing moſt commonly peruert good vſe certainly taber doth ſooner ſounde make men merrie alwayes lightly ſome vanitie ſay ſuperfluous beaſtly behold men ſo caried away cannot ſport themſelues moderate mirth ſling themſelues ayre though would leape themſelues thus iob ment note heere curſed mirth mirth god condemneth vvhereby ought take warning reſtreyne ſelues whereas ſee many whoſe whole delight ſeeke ſuch paſtimes let v ſay miſcheefe haue ſame curſe light vpon ſelues let v learne abſent ſelues ſuch looce wanton paſtimes let v rather aduiſedly reſtreyn ſelues ſet god alwayes eye end hee may bliſſe mirth ſo vſe benefit may neuer ceaſe trauel vp heauenward thus ye ſee behoueth v apply mirth ende namely may melodie ſounding v whereby name god may bliſſed glorified lorde ieſus chriſt nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele wee may hartily ſorie returning vnto deſyre mortifie whole nature ruling thought affection rightuouſneſſe making v newe creature ende may ſo paſſe world may hindered ſtumbling block bylettes cumbered thruſt way miſeries wee haue indure heere aduerſities god ſendeth tempted proſperitie wicked wee may fight ſtoutly agaynſt temptation euen till hee gather v intoo heauenly reſt make v inioy inheritance hee hath promiſed v whereof yet deſtitute time fayth hope might exerciſed may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people c lxxx sermon third vpon xxj chapter ſermon conteyneth rest declaration xij verſe ſo forth text followeth 13 ſpende dayes vvelth ſodenly go dovvne graue 14 yet ſay vnto god depart v vve deſire knovv thy vvayes 15 vvho almightie vve ſhoulde ſerue vvhat ſhall profit v pray vnto yeſterday declared iob ſpeaketh thoſe abuſe benefit god beſtoweth vpon mortall life ſo caried away pleaſure drunken therwith hereby ought take warning ſo reioyce bee alwayes meaſure v bridle ſelues thing ought moſte put v rememberance god receyuing benefites hee beſtoweth vpon v thing ought drawe v vnto make v loue contrarywiſe ſee reioyce without meaſure order forget god ſo glad thinke neyther ſubiect vnto let v follow modeſtie meane haue ſpoken learne ſo moderate pleaſures wee bee caryed away worlde alſo bicauſe heere mention made flute taboret harpe inſtrumentes muſike let v note thing owne nature good ought v bee put euill vſe muſike ſelfe cannot bee condemned foraſmuch worlde doth almoſt alway abuſe ought ſo much circumſpect place warneth v thereof vvee ſee day whiche vſe muſike doo ſwell poyſon agaynſte god become hardharted wil haue ſongs yea manner ſongs full villanie ribauldrie afterward fall dauncing whiche cheefeſt miſcheefe alway ſuch vnchaſte behauiour dauncing ſelfe abuſe ſpeake truth one worde nothing elſe enticement whoredome without cauſe iob intēding declare child worlde deſpizers god doo paſſe meaſure reioycings ſpeaketh ſounde taboret flute inſtrumentes muſike haue already touched hee dooth ſo condemne theſe thing though euill owne nature conſidereth abuſe therin committed men doo neuer ſo well keepe meaſure vſe muſike modeſtly vice heere noted end may ſo thinke may take ſome profit thereby breefe let v long liſte excuſe vanity committed muſike yet doo ſee ſpirit god condemneth bicauſe men delight much ſette delight pleaſure theſe baſe earthly thing thinke whit vpon god nother aſcribe whole vnto ſumme haue note place lēgth ſayd god wil ſuffer deſpizers maieſtie go theyr graue minute houre haue ſpēt whole lyfe greate ioye pleaſure thing alſo well noted threeſcore thirteenth pſalme although vſeth another ſimilitude wicked go death without impeachement hinderance haue nother band cord thereby prophet ment ſhew child god world doo nothing pine away hang wing ſickneſſe diſeaſes ſuche like thing bandes draw v vnto death pull v backe agayne one ſide wee ſicke ſee death threatneth v therby taught howe frayle thing life yea meſſengers whiche god ſendeth ſay vnto v prepare ſelues haue nothing certayne ſure worlde theſe bandes death draw v vnto againe go pyning cannot dye yea man woulde thinke ſometyme wee ſhould liue halfe yeare ende moſte yet wee go foorth meane ſeaſon diſeaſe continueth ſtill v wee ſee child god wicked ſpende theyr tyme myrth ioye yea luſtie full courage come death ſeemeth euen woulde wiſhe laye downe ſleepe ſeeme ſtrange let v keepe remē brance hath bin alredy declared wit howe iob ment ſhewe although god puniſhe treſpaſſes heere world yet muſt thinke ſleepe hee hath giuen ouer office bicauſe deferreth giue iudgement vntill preſent life paſte yee ſee muſte lifte vp mindes aboue frayle life knowing man hath worlde gotten would deſire yet ceaſſeth miſerable nother muſt therfore attribute felicitic vnto bycauſe muſte come iudge therefore let v tempted become like vnto thoſe deſpiſe god giue themſelues ſport play ſo become drū ken pleaſures let v rather deſire miſerable taſte god goodneſſe bee contented therewith knowing cheefeſt felicitie hee loue v merciful vnto v learne looke vnto heauenly heritage whereof faithfull admoniſhed place noweheerevppon iob ſheweth wicked vtterly reiect god ſay vnto departe v wee deſire knowe thy wayes truth wicked ſpew ſuche blaſphemie renounce god effect doo well declare howe paſſe little deſire nothing elſe rid ſubiection although cannot bring paſſe yet labour go farre ſee proofe thereof men liue without remorſe conſcience willingly wittingly become brute beaſtes ſo make difference betweene good euyll thinke thing lawfull muche ſay vnto god depart v god bee neere v muſte haue eye iudge nother muſte wee thinke ſay thing preſence nother muſt accept thing though would iudged ſuch would haue libertie liue liſte one woulde driue god farre haue none acquaintance verely nexte woordes namely wee none thy wayes declare thing haue vnderſtand neere vnto god go farre referred maieſtie god diuine beeyng ſheweth ſelfe viſible vnto creature true may wel haue ſome vnderſtanding wee may knowe beeing infinite ſpreadeth euery yet notwithſtanding cheefe knowledge wee haue god vertues communicateth himſelfe vnto v cheefely telleth v teacheth v maner one ſheweth v ought walke howe life ought bee ruled behold neere vnto whē ſuffer ſelues taught word acknowledging hee whiche ſpeaketh ſheweth himſelfe familiarly vnto v ende ſhould come vnto reſte ſelues furthermore men yeelde themſelues teachable refuze inſtruction deſire ſtark doltes ſo man bring good doctrine make accounte ſteade drawing neere vntoo god men withdrawe themſelues therefore ſayde iob declareth heere thing whiche intended afore witte aſ muche wicked deſpyzers god loth ſubmit themſelues god wayes withdrawe themſelues much therefore wee none wayes ſay ſay get thee away v text wherof may gather good profitable leſſon firſte ſhewed v roote foundation good life namely haue god eye true wee cannot eſchewe behooueth v parte come neere vnto cauſe holye ſcripture intendeth ſignifie man hath led holy life ſayeth hath god eye contrariwiſe ſayeth man hath turned backe god ſheweth regarded god mind one ſayde man runne aſtray gyuen ouer euill finally paſte recouerye manner ſpeaking therefore notable thing vvhy ſo wee bee inclined alreadie nature vnto vncleanneſſe howe wee get hard thing men alter themſelues offer force violence theyr pleaſures delightes ſo man might knowe bee renewed ſay men ſay harde thing man wyll alwayes runne farre aſtray euill bee woonderfull power force make turne heade gyue ouer owne witte reſon haue ſayde afore men wyll continually go forewarde vntoo euill vntill bee reformed hee ſhall reforme cannot doo themſelues nother creature bring paſſe therefore god muſte fayne woorke way helpe god preſence ſo man may bee broughte ſay himſelfe go behooueth mee walke god iudge meanes eſcape hande man haue conſideration may hee fighte agaynſte wicked luſtes ſo whereas bene gyuen euyll hee ſhall bee ready followe good agayne beſides wicked affection cary v away wee bee ſo blinded euerye v maketh himſelfe beleeue euill good wee diſcerne vntill god inlighten v ſo long walke one another like mouse chaſſe prouerbe ſayeth ſay order amongs v euery man abuſe neighbour like wretched beaſts goeth guideth way ill like pore blinde man like deceiue go wont go make cuſtome law thē meanes ſhew v right way looke vnto god haue neere vnto v ſee two reaſōs wei declare vnto v thing neceſſary v let euery man preſent himſelfe god lette v drawe neere vnto let v take heede wee eſtraunge ſelues onely bridle tame v ſubdue v good whereas otherwiſe ſhoulde take beaſtly libertie woulde draw v euill againe god giueth v wiſedome diſcretion knoweth verye well good v neceſſarie ſtaye v ende none v ſhoulde wander owne fooliſh fantaſies follow god plaine whiche rule rightuouſneſſe equitie wee walke becommeth • v • let v beginne end ſay let v draw neere vnto god ſhall draw neere vnto firſt let v knowe nothing hid thing muſte come accompt hee muſte iudge euen thoughtes alſo thus much concerning firſt furthermore let v know god iudge v worde without cauſe named ſharpe ſwoorde two edge muſte examine moſte ſecrete thoughtes maree within bone thing ſo ſecrete ſhall examined worde therfore wee knowe bee meanes make v draw nere vnto god may alwayes haue eye attempte nothing vnder obedience following whiche heere conteyned whereas whiche like bee ignorant wayes god ſhut eye light thruſt god much poſsibly let v ſeeke knowe thē hereby taught howe ought eſteeme worde god cheefeſt felicitie god draw neere vnto v vnto ſhall done meanes done hee parte commeth downe v deliuereth worde vnto vs▪ doeth teſtifie vnto v hee dwell amongſt v receiue worde much receiued god homage ende hee might raigne ouer v foraſmuch god preſent v meanes worde ſee greater miſfortune happē vnto v thā god ſuffreth v wāder fātaſies without guiding whē haue doctrine ſaluatiō draweth v vnto contrariwiſe greateſt moſt ineſtimable treaſure haue god gouer neth v taught wil haue certaine teſtimony receiue v vnto himſelf people world knoweth therfore ſo much place wel noted v furthermore let v knowe ſtubborne cannot bow neck vnder god yoake much thruſt farre truth thinke themſelues greatly iniured men call thē mortall enimies god ſay ſeeke nothing elſe thruſt authoritie myghte eaſilye treade vnder foote oh ſay meane ſuch thing yea make holy ghoſtea lyar hath playnely taught whiche ſubmit themſelues doctrine ſaluation fight againſt god vttermoſt power would baniſh world cannot abide ſhould raigne enioy authoritie ſee holy ghoſt ſayeth foraſmuch cace ſtandeth ſo guiltie ſuche ſacrilege let v learne humble ſelues whenſoeuer god ſendeth woorde amongſt v let v tremble thereby declare ſeeke nothing elſe preſēt god alwayes beholde walke know wel muſt make accompt whole life eſcape hand moreouer let v long preſence god ynoughe haue eye vpon god muſt deſire alwaies ſight vnder guiding ſometime moſt wicked haue eye vnto god ſhalbe galey ſlaues doo fall rowing ſee themſelues faſte chayned ſurelye beaten muſt needes force conſtraint wicked god ſpeaketh knowe preſent lay would deſtroy godheade againſt would alſo thruſt god kingdome el would flee holie scripture reporteth ſhall ſay vnto mountaines couer v ſee wicked doo alwayes flee preſence god bycauſe terrible vnto nowe behalf haue ſayde muſt onely knowe neere vnto v muſte deſire alwayes preſence knowing ſtate condition miſerable god doth behold v vvhether go deſtruction whē god ſafegarde wee thinke ſaue oure ſelues aſſurāce guide let v learne pray vnto god neuer depart v whatſoeuer happen may ſo let v pray make v feele taſte infinite goodneſſe inlightening v worde wee may knowe hee iudge whole world wee muſte render accompt doings haue ſaide alſo thoughtes truth cannot drawen vnto good willes vvhat muſt muſte acknowledge bee father dede ſheweth himſelſe ſo vvhē know ſo good pitifull certaine ſeeke boldely come neere vnto become thither wil deſire nothing el cōtinue euē end meanes world ſwarue thus much haue note place namely ſhould haue god eye alſo ſhoulde deſire looke vpon v guide v iob hath ſhewed forth ſuch blaſphemie wicked deſpizers god hee addeth moreouer ſay almightie ſhould ſerue profit ſhall wee get praying vnto iob ſetteth pride faithleſſe wicked men place worthy noted holy ſcripture ſheweth principal vice wicked pride contrariwiſe humilitie chiefeſt vertue faithful haue humilitie beſides thereby wee learne diſpleaſed ſelues yea wholly cōdemne ſelues ſpoile ſelues opiniō vertue come vnto god ſeeke whole felicitie beſides ſay ſhall knowe behoueth v ſubiects vnto hath rule ouer v ſee humilitie mother roote vertues contrarie parte pride beareth rule men muſt need whole life frowad wicked nowe pryde heere attributed faythleſſe firſt conceiue maruelouſly themſelues truſte owne wiſedome wee ſee neuer come end bicauſe ſo puffed vp preſumptiō wiſe yea deſpite god thinke ſhoulde abace themſelues much ſhoulde forſake owne iudgement harken ſet forth vnto name god farther haue ſuch confidence wiſedom giue themſelues bridle theyr delight pleaſures reproued therfore thinke greatly iniured ye ſee thē faythleſſe alwaies drowned prefumptiō cauſe prophet habacuk fetteth hautineſſe againſt faith ſignifiying therby faith alwaies leadeth men true humilitie obedience contrariwiſe faythleſſe man muſt needes alwaies exalt lift vp himſelfe againſt god impoſsible otherwiſe therfore without cauſe iob heere ſpeaking wicked armeth thē ſuch pride think ſhould ſubmit thēſelues god ſay almightie wee ſhoulde ſerue truth vtter ſuch word mouthe except god diſcouer ſometimes happeneth hypocrite ſpew horrible thing cauſe therof god conſtraineth would gladly hide themſelues end filthineſſe might knowen worlde god ſuffer according ſaid knowe god glorifie god deliuered vnto reprobate minde ſo gyuen wickedneſſe get themſelues euill name owne follie god ſometime ſuffer wicked ſpeake ſayde although holde theyr peace make goodly proteſtations ſerue god yet heart beare ſuch ſpite againſt god wiſh hee none authoritie ouer ſaying themſelues almightie wee ſhoulde ſerue example worſte men bee choſen ſay firſte one god meere ſhould honored v yea generall termes deede confeſſe ſo much whē come clozing ſay man goeth rule ſayeth vnto hath god declared wil vnto v ſorte haue v walke▪ ſhall ſee heare ſide man woulde pull couetous perſon couetouſneſſe reprooue ambitious man vice whoremonger drunkard blaſphemer theyr faultes kycke agaynſt god woulde fayne haue full libertie doo euill although doe vtter theſe wordes mouth almightie yet ſwell like toades yeelde themſelues ſubiect vnto god ſee iob accuſeth onely open mouth haue vttered blaſphemie whereof hee ſpeaketh alſo thoſe ſo ſwollen thēſelues ſay filled ſuch arrogancie humbly ſubmit themſelues god acknowledge meete hee ſhoulde haue ſoueraintie ouer ſhort▪ condemned theſe men wee muſte compare god ſelues foraſmuche creatour wee muſt acknowledge hee ought haue whole dominion thing ought ſubiect vnto thus much item ſeeing hath redeemed v deathe paſsion onely begotten sonne hee hath well deſerued haue ſouerayntie ouer v nowe hee hath purchaſed v ſo dearly muſt addicted ſelues wholly dedicated ſeruice furthermore muche father wee muſte bee child cauſe alſo hee ſayeth prophete malachie bee lorde feare father loue honor owe vnto mee god declareth truely ſubiects vntill wee acknowledge right hee hath ouer v gyue title dignity hee mayſter lord muſt giue reuerence ſeeing acknowledge bee father meete ſhoulde honour yea true loue childe ſuch wicked monſter euery man abhorreth deteſteth wyll honour father whiche certaine vnleſſe hee loue ſee muſte looke vnto god wee bee ſo come ſelues ala poore creature wee bee man whereof hee may glorie nothing curſedneſſe yet hath god honored v hee hath created v owne image likeneſſe although image blotted v ſinne adam wee bring nothing mother wombe curſe yet god created v owne image one great excellent honor beſide hee hath vouchſafed redeeme v bloude onely begotten sonne ieſus chriſt whome hee woulde ſpare moreouer hath called v houſholde ſeruice owne child heyres vvhen wee ſhall haue made theſe compariſons hart yron ſteele ſhould pray ſoftened yf ſhould ſwell arrogancie ſo ſhould burſt withall ought poyſon purged true humilitie come obedience god cauſe hee intendeth make v willing obey commaundementes acknowledge auctoritie hath ouer v hee vſeth preface lawe eternall thy god vvhen ſayeth eternall bringeth v backe creation ſhewe v haue faſhioned ſayeth nothing haue created worlde parte thereof muſte holde beeing mee homage know mee creator tremble vnder mee nowe hath thus ſpoken hee ſayeth farther thy god ſhew father people thoſe inſtruct worde fatherhoode ought haue ſayde bring v louing reuerence thirdly hee rehearſeth benefites made people bounden vnto vvell nowe greater excellent benefites beſtowed vpon v hath drawen v earthly bondage depth hell moyſes lorde ieſus chriſt seeing ſo ſee wee meanes bounden vnto therefore meete henceforth ſhoulde addicted ſelues euery mā ſhould bee readie wholly dedicate himſelfe ſeruice god concerning iob addeth moreouer certaine wee knowe taught v holye scripture ſay profite praying vnto lorde might well ſay vnto v ſerue mee commaunde without ſetting forth vnto v hyre reward bounden vnto taught haue done ſhall bee commaunded yet vnprofitable ſeruants ſay god ſhall neuer bee dette bounden giue ſelues wholly vnto god mighte ſimplie cōmaunde without adding promiſſe yet doth apply himſelfe vnto v ſeing wee coulde bee brought ſerue vnleſſe hee made v ſome promiſſe ſayeth ſerue addeth bee father bee defender life ayde neceſsities beſide content theſe promiſes deede ſhould auayle v vnleſſe went farther thing hee doth hee ſayeth forgiue ſinnes receyue mercie wil blot iniquity afterward vphold although frayle ſerue mee altogither ought doo yet wyll take well woorth halfe ſeruice doo mee youre father ſtraightly examine doings thus many promiſes doth god make v bind v vnto hereby ſeene wee haue none excuſe ſay profite ſerue god though wee flee yet wee bee without mayſter walke randon ſay bridle let looſe ſpite teethe ſhall ſerue ſhall bee owne luſtes diuell heathen men coulde ſay moſte miſerable ſeruice ſtraighteſt bondage amongſt men bee ſubiecte owne vice lothus haue heathen men themſelues ſpoken theſe diueliſhe miſtreſſes luſtes ſhame v beeing taught woorde god halfe king haue ſuche vnbrideled libertie nothing vnruly euen liſt certaine haue ſayde wee coulde miſerable curſed bondage beſide diuel hath whole rule ouer v ſo wee eſcape ſubiection wee bee exempted rightuouſneſſe paule meaneth hee ſayeth 6 romanes freed onely rightuouſneſſe hee vſeth ſimilitude bondman time paſte franchyſed might bee ſubiect maiſters bee franke free ſtate condition ſo ſayeth men ieſus chriſt freed ſo libertie doo euill ſubiecte rightuouſneſſe god therefore true libertie nay cleane contrary ſayth ſerued ſinne while tooke hold vppon rightuouſneſſe god cace directeth talke faithfull ſayeth aſhamed thinke vpon life paſſed know diuell rule ouer youre ruine deſtruction aſhamed ſelues call remembrance ſo forſaken god wandred lyke brute beaſtes ſtate condition thoſe exempt themſelues ſeruice god contrarie part ſerue god certaine ſeruice honorable thā enioy kingdome heere hath bene declared god doth call v ende ſhould bee ſtate condition ſeruants take v owne child seeing ſo wee ſee well loſte labour gyue ſelues ſeruice god neyther muſt wee alledge ſay profit ſhall get thereby ſeeing lorde maiſter doth tell v al oure bliſſedneſſe walke feare contrariwiſe greater miſfortune happē vnto v exempt oure ſelues ſeruice thus much haue note furthermore lette v extende ſame farther iob alſo doth meaneth wicked proſperitie gyue themſelues ſporte play thinke one liue well ill making mocke god thinke fauoreth thē firſte ſtroke hee throwe downe howe vvhen god ſpareth wicked paſſe theyr bound wicked doings therevpon become harde harted thinke goeth well doo perceyue god plague beginne deſpiſe rebell ſayth salomon ſee wicked thinke profit ſeruing god much better gyue themſelues euill god firſt doth execute iudgements contrary part muſt thus conclude ſelues prophet eſay ſpeaketh ſay yee ſurely ſhall go well rightuous therefore wee ſee confuſion thing worlde ſeemeth vnto v mockerie ſerue god yet muſte ſtill continue ſure perſwaſion lorde mayſter diſappoynte wayte vppon haue bene led vayne hope looking reward hand may ſay dauid lorde reward alſo ſayeth vnto abraham abraham walke mee thine exceeding greate rewarde thus muſt fight againſt temptation cōmon namely men beginne miſtruſt promiſſe god ſee wicked proſper poore faithful afflicted tormēted euery ſide vvell yet worde note iob hath ſpoken ſeruice god▪ ſeconde place ſetteth prayer ſay reuerence men vnto god humbling themſelues vnder making requeſt vnto without cauſe iob vſe worde truth god honored ſerued v charitie brotherly loue temperāce humilitie ſuch like thing hee haue v loue one ſeeke releeue neighbour euery man ſubmit himſelfe commaunded calling requireth liue togither euery man apply himſelf labour without deceyuing mā ſeruice god acceptable ſacrifizes vnto yet ſerue god well muſt begin end namely honor giuing prayſe due vnto done ſupplication prayer example man walke without euill ſo cannot bee accuſed hath deceyued man hee hath bene cruell hee hath troubled neyghbour bee conuinced either whoredome drunkēneſſe ſhort hath abſteined notable vice ſight men yet haue nother religion fayth harte hath quite forſaken god ſhall life accepted god nothing vanitie nothing filthineſſe god haue giuen vnto men apperteyneth vnto deceyue god▪ robbe preheminence authoritie ſhoulde god haue greater priuiledge without compariſon al creature without cauſe iob minding ſhew true ſeruice god putteth downe ſpeciall kinde ſeruice weete prayer come preſent oure ſelues prayer according holy ſcripture ſheweth cheefe ſacrifize god requireth v ſayd fiftith pſalme hath refuſed al ceremony wherwith hypocrite make ſhew ſeruing whē haue doone many goodly outwarde thing thinke god greately bounde heare vvhat god requireth v call vpon mee day thy neede heare thee ſo ſhalt thou glorifie mee cheefe ſeruice therfore god requireth v wee call vpon knowing wee come vnto truth make v parttakers benefites ſo gouerne v ſpirite ſhal neuer bereft grace cauſe iob minding ſhewe ſeruice god ſayeth pray vnto thing moſt excellēt ſhort wee learne hereby intende leade well diſpoſed lyfe ſuche one god alloweth accepteth wee muſte firſte put truſt knowing wee bee wretched creature wee haue recourſe vnto goodneſſe contrarywiſe wee ſtay ſelues vpon wee ſhall want nothing knoweth bee expedient ſaluation furthermore lette v take heede giue good example men wee bee cruell neyghbours rather indeuer helpe tymes caces bearing weake communicating thing wee haue vnto needie vvhen lyfe thus ruled true ſeruing god wee robbe god honour make pretence ſerue yet liue like cattes dogges among ſelues true mouthe wee ſhall make proteſtation wee ſerue god appeare deede mortall enimies nothing v rebelliouſneſſe wee nothing make warre agaynſt lyfe long nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue heeretofore done ende wee may bee ſorie therewithall ſeeke remedie ſo beeing purged clenzed ſinnes wee may ſeeke nothing elſe cleaue vnto rightuouſneſſe wee may ſo let v alwaies looke vnto knowing well hee hath placed v world end ſhould alwaies go forward vnto yea ſuch ſorte doubt hee hath fatherly care ouer v meane ſeaſon let v deſire inſtructed worde would alwaies lighten v outward workes alſo thought affection ſo hart minde may wholly giuen ende holy name may bee glorified oure whole life may pleaſe graūt grace v alſo people nation c lxxxj sermon fourth vpon xxj chapter 16 proſperitie ovvne hande let intent vvicked farre mee 17 hovv candle vvicked put deſtruction commeth vpon god deuideth line vvrath 18 chaffe vvinde ſtubble vvhirlevvinde 19 lorde hideth ſtrength sonnes payeth ſhall ſee 20 eye ſhall ſee deſtruction drinketh furie almightie 21 vvhat pleaſure leaueth houſe ſeeth dayes ſhortened haue ſhewed minde iob wit iudgements god worlde ſo apparant eye man may thervpon certainely conclude according euery man liueth well ill ſo puniſhed receyueth god hande due wage rather tranſitorie life cōfuſion thing ſo wicked liueth eaſe godly tormēted dayes life yet iob doth acknowledge god ceaſſeth rightuous iudge men ſhould ſtay vpō preſent eſtate thing true felicitie wicked enioy while god winketh faultes ſparing vvee ſee briefe ſumme diſcourſe iob maketh thing profitable firſt conſider matter worlde harde thing perſwade v god doth guyde thinketh beſt men ſo vnder hande gouernance muſte needes come accompt ſay enter head el tyme wee perceyue yet fully perſwaded therein ſee howe hypocrite thinke deceyue god contrarie parte alſo ſuffer harme wee ſee thing well ordered god ſuffereth wicked paſſe theyr boundes ſo ſeemeth mindeth puniſh begin doubt enter terrible thought ſaying vvhat god care worlde thing guyded ſhould ſee manner gouernment thus much one poynt agayne aſ much wee carnall god worke according minde thinke ſhal neuer come time ſee iudgemēts day thinke morowe late cannot haue ſuche pacience quietneſſe ſelues ſay god knoweth conuenient time wil execute iudgements ſhall ſee good perteyneth vnto v appoynt day houre lyeth handes becauſe fleſhly much muſte wee remember leſſon conteyned wit wee paſſe aboue worlde oure faith ſurmount thing heere beneath wee ſee wicked bee proſperitie good bee maruelouſly afflicted ſame ſtay v ſo hinder v ſhould make v faynte let v lifte vp ſelues fayth may know wel true god ſo letteth looſe bridle wicked man would thinke life happie contrariwiſe wee ſee good godly tormented payne anguiſh ſo man would thinke god forſaken thought let v tarie leyſure go forwarde thus muſt practiſe doctrine taught v iob haue ſeene wherefore hee thus reaſoneth bycauſe freendes would make beleeue hee wicked man hee ſo afflicted hande god grieuous temptation offenſiue vvee muſte arme ſelues heere ſet v ende god viſite v handled roughly may ſo oppreſſed confuſion deſpayre get vpper hande v let v know god ceaſſeth loue v pitie v although ſhew himſelfe ſo rough time thus ſee ſecond place muſt apply doctrine ſelues let v note thing particularly iob heere proteſteth although wicked puniſhed firſte fault yet ought man therfore thinke happie hee knoweth theyr felicitie ſhall continue god ſhall make ende it▪ proſperitie ſayeth hee owne hande hee ſhoulde ſay reaſon god dealeth euery man according deſertes wee ſee cleane cōtrary ſo thinke wicked ſhal eſcape one whit better cheape bee lordes owne ſtate ſay god holdeth bridle depriue pleaſures thing whiche thinke make full perfect felicitie yea ſo blinded themſelues ſo puffed vp pride thinke themſelues halfe angel briefe recken themſelues daunger vvell theyr prosperitie theyr owne hande ſay deceyue themſelues vayne imagination dreame ſay lyfe ſo happie therefore intent farre mee ſay bee blinded preſent felicitie mē ſee wicked made drunken vvee ſee iob ment declare theſe woordes therfore may better profite doctrine lette v note ſee wicked preuayle god holdeth ſecrete bridle mouthes ſo haue day ſhall taken morrow haue nothing theyr owne power well printed hart ſhould ſo troubled thing whiche beholde eye bycauſe wee thinke whatſoeuer wee ſee day ſhoulde continue euer true wee graunt world goeth rounde thing chaunged euery minute houre nothing certaine nothing ſure conſtant wee doo affirme playnely ynough mouth wee thinke harte ſo day proſperitie heade ſo incombred wee thinke wee make reckoning withoute hoſte wee haue affliction wee ſay alwayes bee thus wee thinke wee ſhall neuer ſee ende tyme wee grieued proſperitie wicked wee imagine ſhall neuer come decaye ſtande feare taken ſuch feare thinke remedie man ſay vnto v let v abide paciently god ſhall prouide ſtay ſelues vpon god prouidence thus ſee howe preſent thing carie v away wee ſo encombred wee haue ſtay oure mindes neyther call vppon god committe ſelues know prouide thing due tyme place muche diligentlye muſte learne doctrine ſayde prosperitie wicked theyr owne hande ſay men may bee proſperitie life hangeth threede wee haue ſeene whiche thinke haue haue way borowing moment ſhall taken let v know wee knowe god beſtowe benefites vppon v concerning preſente life let v acknowledge come yea bee ready bee ſpoyled clothed beholde lorde thou haſte giuen mee wherewith lyue certayne ſure thereof muſte make mine account enioy euer ſo long
