ſhall bee thy good wyll pleaſure thus ſhall come paſſe faithfull poſſeſsing thing ſhall poſſeſſed paule ſayeth perſwade themſelues thing euer know may become poore ſhall pleaſe god nothing ſhall bee ſtraunge vnto ſhall happen alſo contrary parte god ſende v pouertie let v thinke thus well lorde thou haſte rich thy hande thou couldeſte beſtowe vpon v thou diddeſt ſee good meane ſeaſon lette bee thy pleaſure feede v thou ſeeſt neede vouchſafe helpe v ſuffer v afflicted beyonde meaſure alſo wee ſee wicked glorie welth nothing lette v knowe whiche thinke haue hande haue bicauſe lorde aboue wee muſte keepe remembrance furthermore ſayde let intent wicked farre v let v learne muſt darke fall ſleepe thing preſent ſtande muche owne conceyte wealth aboundance angry god hee handle v owne minde vve muſte become ſuch intent wicked god ſendeth thing deſire ſo puffed vp pride man longer beare wyll acknowledge themſelues bee mortall men exalte themſelues aboue degree aſcende ſo highe ende muſte needes fall breake necke man ſhall finde nothing arrogancie ſpiritual drunkenneſſe become ſo beaſtly tyme man ſpeake vnto deathe ſickneſſe pouertie thinke come neere man dooth greate iniurie ſay ſo vnto man go aboute humble ſay vnto let v knowe howe weake frayle ſtate condition wyll aunſwere yea men bee counted number ſo dealt withall thus wicked become ſo proude proſperitie dealing ſhorte forget men creature perſwade themſelues ſubiecte correction god layeth vpon v world furthermore bee afflicted rage gnaſhe teethe bite nayle agaynſte god man ſhall ſee fome mouth theyr rage cauſe haue yet learned ſubmit themſelues vnder hande god offer themſelues vnto ſacrifice ende may dedicated vnto bee dealte withall ſhall pleaſe knowe nothing meaneth god dealeth v fauourably wee muſte bridle ſelues knowing declareth vnto v fatherly loue ende might draw v vnto ſhould come vnto true humilitie becō meth v ſaying well lorde ſeeing thou ſheweſt thy ſelfe ſo fauourable meete ſhoulde cleaue vnto thee placing felicitie cō trariwiſe thou ſhalte afflicte mee ſhall ſaye well lorde thou doeſt waken mee leaſt ſhould ſtay ſelfe become careleſſe beneath putting truſt confidence world earthly thing thou wilt humble mee tame mee ende ſhould ſo much couragiouſly looke vnto thee myght atteyne vnto thy heauenly kingdome thus muſte haue intentes ſeuered wicked ſay oure mindes may ſo entāgled worldly thing ſhould make v become brute beaſtes ſo drunken ſhoulde thinke vpon god contrarywiſe wee muſte contemne deſpize thoſe thing wherein wicked woont delight knowing although wee bee poore miſerable yet oure ſtate worſe bicauſe haue good hope god wyll haue pitie compaſsion v ſūme haue note place iob addeth howe lampe wicked quenchea deſtruction come vpon howe hath god ſettled liues ſorrowes confirmation hath bene already hearde woorde lampe iob ſetteth theyr proſperitie according holy scripture vſeth maner ſpeach namely cō paring good worlde bryghtneſſe affliction darkeneſſe hee ſayeth lampe wicked ſhall quenched ſpeaketh admiration bycauſe ſame ſo doone paſſeth man witte otherwiſe wee conceyue haue ſayde haue eye ſo bleared wee ſee farre god mindeth neither hath playnly ſpoken vvhen wee ſee wicked proſper wee thinke proſperitie ſhall neuer quenched wee cannot comprehende althoughe scripture ſpeaketh although wee haue experience dayly wee ſee god throweth downe wicked exalted euen vp clowdes vvhen haue ſeene thinke neyther thinke thing euer come paſſe yet god hath ſhewed v poynted oute finger much man witte doth aſcende ſo high ſo faſte tyed thing preſent wee cannot conceyue god mindeth doo iob ſpeaketh heere ſtraunge thing ſayeth hee lampe wicked quenched theyr deſtruction come vpon hee ſayeth theyr deſtruction commeth vpon hee ſheweth god entreateth wycked gentlye time wee muſte faſten eye vpon earth reaſon whether god iudge whether wicked ſhall puniſhed end muſt cō ſider may happen behalfe whereas drunken wealth wheras lifted vp pryde whereas thinke harme cā happen vnto creature appoynted ſerue nothing god ſhall ſende theyr deſtruction aboue nowe whereas ſhould looke vp high ment ſhould looke according outwarde ſenſe ſhall attayne vnto god greate diſtance ſhould faint way vvhat muſt let v behold god fayth let v lift vp inwarde ſenſes aboue ſelues thus muſt wee iudge fall wicked ſay muſt conſider ſo much may happē vnto thē according world god able power god infinite power paſſeth capacitie ſerueth teach v thing ſeeme impoſsible mē muſt ſticke cōclude thus god worketh faſhion hidde vnknowen vnto v euen ſuch ſort ſhalbe cōſtrayned wōder heare ſame done yea god ſhewe v ſubiect worldly meanes thing doth muſte maruelous eye ſumme whiche wee muſte remember ſayde god 〈…〉 theyr cordes wrath true 〈…〉 cordes ſome expounded sorrowes alſo may takē naturall ſenſe god wrath ſette portion worde cordes sriptures taken portiō bicauſe old time men woulde lay grounde aker ſay meaſure ground vſed line holy scripture applieth ſimilitude order god prouidence euen lande meaſured ſet meeres boundes diuide poſſeſsions ende euery man may haue hys right thing may cōfuſed ſo god prouidence doth bring order whiche confuſed much ſtretch line nowe ſayd god ſtretch yea ſhall wrath teach v ſhould muche amazed thing come well paſſe firſt example thing ſhall ſeeme vnto v turned vpſide downe worlde ther bridle cord wicked take pleaſure caſt themſelues ouerthwart field good men trodē vnder foote aſſaulted great crueltie extortion remedie appeareth euill waxeth worſe worſe god maketh thoughe hee turned backe iuſtice worlde mightieſt carieth bell away ſhort midſt great ſtormes thing world turned vpſide downe yet muſte ſwallowed vp deſperation let v tarie till god ſpreade cordes wrath although day hide theſe cord doth ſet boūds inſomuch thing brought good order yet hath alwaies cordes hand well declare knoweth howe ſpreade make partition doth firſte bicauſe yet due time true neuer ceaſſeth iudge wicked firſte ſhewe vengeance vpon ſo ſoone put execution hee hath decreed himſelfe alſo expedient v furthermore behoueth wicked made vnexcuſable whiche thing brought paſſe god calleth repentance ſayeth paule bearing ſo muche bee blamed haue ſo abuſed goodneſſe pacience beſides good men tormented haue wherwith hū ble themſelues meete meanes faith ſhould exerciſed ende might pacientlie wayte helpe god knowing ſaluation hid much lyeth hope hereby god ſtirreth vp come vnto ende ſhould ſeeke inheritance without worlde see lord without cauſe deferreth iudgementes time alwayes conuenient execute wrath knoweth better ſumme haue learne verſe ſayde moreouer ſhal ſtubble winde vvhereby iob meeneth roote felicitie wherein wicked glory ſo proude ſimilitude muche vſed ſo needeth bee expounded thing well knowne vnto v alſo ſtubble caried away wynde tempeſt iob proteſteth heere felicitie wicked ſo rooted whirlewinde god wrath commeth vpon ſhall vaniſh melt away quite cleane ſo ſhall nothing left therewithall let v note ſheweth howe wrath god ſhall come minute houre ſhal think ſaid wicked ſhall bee taken ſuddenly ſhall ſay peace ſafetie behold ſodaine deſtruction ſhal ouerwhelme ſhall throwes woman childe take hir ſodeinly ſhe thinketh iob would expreſſe ſame ende ſhould ſo grieue v ſhould pine away god ſend thing wold wiſh deed cauſe wee bee ſo impacient god ſuffereth thing go hauocke bicauſe think needeth long preparation would haue god ſhewe ſome token working wee woulde haue ſome ſight long ſhort haue god like mortall man though ſhould maruellouſly troubled taketh worke hande ſhould need ſeeke helpe ayde bring purpoſe paſſe thus wee would make god whole maieſtie ſubiect ſtate condition vvhat muſt wee doe let v knowe minute houre hee finiſh worke yea ſhall bee meanes thinges whit diſpoſed thereto let v learne felicitie menne dreame ſpecially thinke themſelues happie become proude proſperitie fonde imagination ſone vaniſheth away bicauſe ther roote much better v bee miſerable ſight men meane ſeaſon haue liuely roote god knowe wee ſhall neuer bee deſtitute ſtrength ayde let v knowe cheefeſt felicitie ſufficient v haue reſte nothing reſpecte meane ſeaſon althoughe ſeeme vntoo v wicked ſhall alwayes remayne ſtate condition god hath ſo eſtabliſhed ſhall neuer bee moued alſo puffed vp pryde ſaid pſalme ſhall neuer harme come neare let v ceaſſe comprehend iudgement god declared ſay ſodaine hee ſhall neede order thing long god aboue al common order nature ſo worke faſhion new ſtrange v nowe iob addeth herewithall god puniſheth wicked owne perſons alſo extendeth chaſtizements puniſhmentes euen vnto child wicked ſhall life time know nothing vanitie ſtate yea nill perceyue ſtande vppon vnſure grounde god haue caſt downe true ceaſe pryde howe ſo euer bee god vrgeth ſo farre perceyue alwayes continue ſo ſumme iob meant intreate heere haue note firſt ſpeaketh child according common doctrine holie scripture ſay god bliſſeth onley faythfull themſelues alſo continueth fauour vpon child thus ſee god beareth v ſuch loue content thinketh ynough haue care ſaluation giue v knoweth bee meete profitable v alſo hee embraceth child ſheweth himſelfe father likewiſe vve ſee howe goodneſſe god deſcribed vntoo v holie scripture hath receyued v vnto teſtified vnto v vnder hand protection ſheweth alſo ſame fauoure vnto child ſakes seeing ſo wee haue good cauſe repoſe ſelues wee muſt conclude ſake hee continueth fauoure towardes ſucceede v ſtrong reaſon wee ſhall alwayes finde mercyfull father ought miſtruſt goodneſſe ſeeing ſo fauorable haue care ouer alſo come v nowe contrarie part ſayde god curſeth race wicked howe deſtitute guyding holie ghoſt ſo muſt go naught heerein haue none occaſion murmure grudge againſte god ſome wil thinke ſtrange vvhat ſay poſsible god ſhould puniſhe child father ſake ſayde hee ſinneth ſhall beare owne iniquitie sonne ſhall puniſhed father ſake yes truely ſuch ſorte ſonne hathe cauſe complayne though rightuous god notwithſtanding puniſhment due vnto father cauſeth fall vpon innocent guiltleſſe happen ſayde god requite iniquitie father boſome sonnes doth wrong leaueth wicked nowe wee forſaken god wee doe miſchiefe thus ſee god ſheweth ſuche fauour wicked giue holie ſpirite ſo diuell muſt needes raigne ouer ſtirre vp prouoke wrathe god haſten deſtruction childrē wrapped vp togither father houſe curſed god ſame poſſeſsion thraldom satan ſpirit god ruleth therfore child ſo puniſhed father iuſt iudgement vpon themſelues alſo ſay giltleſſe found faultie god well father contrarie parte child faythfull continue folowing ſteps father bliſsing god appeereth ſo menne haue wherefore glorie themſelues child ſay heritage appertayneth vnto v god cauſeth v proſper bycauſe father worthie haue ſuche ſucceſsion whole muſt bee attributed onely free goodneſſe god worketh beeing bounden vntoo men neyther owing anye thing bycauſe ſo pleaſeth hym thē haue learne ſayd although god puniſhe wicked firſt yet addreſſe himſelfe child ſay hee reſerue puniſhment proſecute matter wee muſt giue iudgement vpon prouidence god maye bee ſeene world muſt quiet mynds ſtay iudgement vntill god ſhewe time come becommeth v appoynt time men froward make ſuche haſte ſee god hath peculiar faſhion dooings whiche ſometimes ſtraunge vnto v yet muſt humble mind ſay lorde like well ſo euer thou ſhalt although bee agreeing fantaſie haue note vpon worde hide reſerue ſayd god reſerueth child wicked puniſhment hath executed vpon father true enter intoo men head neyther common doctrine cauſe wherefore ſayde muſt herevnto apply whole ſtudie menne owne nature ſo haſtie impacient woulde haue god ſet eye mindeth neither giue place prouidence excepte hee make hande verie manifeſt contrarie part vpon condition wee placed worlde wee ſhoulde bee continuall combates knowing worlde wee muſt bee toſſed turmoyled way waye ſo let v exerciſe ſelues theſe reſeruations heere mencioned vvhen wee ſee wicked ſo triumphe ſeemeth god hath giuen priuiledge aboue men well let v waite ſtill heere mention made reſeruing hyding vvee ſee yet meant therfore let v take heed iudge thing vnknowne ſo might reproued raſhneſſe ſhall ſee ſhall pleaſe god open eye execute hee hath determined himſelfe meane ſeaſon alſo let v put doctrine vre taught v cōcerning reſeruation benefites god hath prepared faythfull ſayd hidden repoſe truſt god cōfort ſelues hath promiſed v wee muſt aſcende aboue worlde behold thing inuiſible whoſoeuer ſhal ſtay himſelf vpon manifeſt vnto renounceth fayth hope ſhort ſhetteth vp gate ſaluaton himſelfe furthermore haue alreadie touched iob ſhewed wicked ſhall well perceyue caſe nothing vanitie follie meaneth feele deede nother bee touched ambicion blinde men altogither dulheads certaine aſſone perceyued thēſelues miſerable exalting thē ſelues would yeeld themſelues obedient vnto god haue ſuch confidence world hapneth vnfaythfull exalt themſelues day ſo mad arrogancie preſumption ſubmit themſelues equitie reaſon doe thinges deſpite god deſpiſing grace whence commeth ſuch rage bicauſe know prepared ſeeing ſee nothing al ſay although god ſhew many token wrath yet knowe nothing true deede puniſhed haue within ſome pricking torment much ſo euer yet touched quicke might knowe deſtruction hande touched harme might happen vnto thē according iudgemēt world deede great perplexitie ſay muſte prouide againſt ſuch danger whereinto might fall ſee howe caſe ſtandeth wicked thing ought note well ynough v bee touched lightly puffe make v feele frayltie ſmall matter god doth deede conſtrayne wicked ſo farre yet neuer better wee ſee ſtill obſtinate ſo euer befall vvhat muſt wee doe heare mention made vanitie world thing preſente life let v knowe although men take great paynes aduance themſelues yea bring enterpriſes paſſe yet al nothing bycauſe onely ſhall enioy rich haue heaped togither thought haue doone ſucceſſours alſo ſhall bee curſed ſhall haue ioy vvee maye fret proſperitie wicked frail changeable cannot turn curſe deſtruction thus thē muſt doctrin put vre againe god ſhall ſend v proſperitie plentie let v knowe alſo ſame ſhall continue euer wee muſt ſtill come poynte namely god draw v beyond world therefore let v ſo conſider vanity heere beneath may greeue v ſee ourſelues certaine ſure nothing heere deſire rooted beneath wee ſhall renoūce kingdome heauen whoſoeuer knoweth life god ſhalbe reueled vnto v comming lord ieſus chriſt ſhall greeue toſſed world ſee nothing chopping chaunging thing certain ſure therfore muſt long heauenly life god calleth biddeth v dayly worde yet meane ſeaſon midſt theſe worldly trouble thing ſo diſordered ſe let v ignorant god ſo guydeth gouerneth world prouidence nothing doone beneath without although reaſon thereof manifeſt vnto v firſt yet al ſo dutie quiet tarie paciently vntill god ſhewe v experience end wicked ſhall curſed affliction good men ſhal turned ſaluatiō howbeit whileſt waite till god ſhewe v ſame effect let v walk ſtill vnder quietly let v behaue ſelues frowardly thing happeneth vnto v let v redy ſuffer affliction ſhal pleaſe lay vpon v ſend v proſperitie let meanes make v taſt fatherly goodneſſe draw v vnto let v fal face good god acknowledgement faultes deſiring ſo lighten v world giuing v knoweth bee good v alſo worde midſt darkneſſe al affliction haue ſuffer may ceaſſe ſtill feele goodneſſe fauor ſo follow way ſheweth v may neuer turned therefrom thing happeneth vnto v meane ſeaſon alſo eye blinded neyther proſperitie aduerſitie thing ſoeuer bee wee may behold glaſſe hath giuen v ſay holie worde ſame wee may bee always guided vnto tranſformed image vntill ſuch time haue clenſed v ſinnes haue vtterly aboliſhed v commeth corrupt ſinfull fleſhe gather v fully himſelfe may partaker glorie hath prepared v heauen may pleaſe c lxxxij sermon fift vpon xxj chapter 22 vvho vvil take vpō teach god knovvledge vvho iudgeth higheſt things▪ 23 man dieth full ſtrength eaſe quietly 24 breaſts teates full milke bone flovv vvith maree 25 another dieth vvith great paine neuer eateth vvith pleaſure 26 laide duſt vvormes ſhall couer 27 ignorant theſe thing hovv go vvrong 28 ſay vvhere houſe prince vvhere alſo tent vvicked 29 aske go vvay ye denie ſignes 30 vvicked kept vnto day deſtruction ſhall brought forth day vvrath 31 vvho ſhall ſhevve vvay face vvho ſhall tell againe vvhich hee hath doone 32 ſhall brought graue ſhall layde tombe 33 grauelly earth ſhall ſvveete vnto euerie man ſhall go number vvent infinite 34 comfort vaine anſvveres nothing lye iob proſecuteth matter treated yeſterday wit although ſeeme ſtraunge oure fantaſie god ſhould intreat men ſo confuſedly yet becommeth v reproue wage law againſt iuſtice murmure though euill muſt humble ourſelues maieſtie knowing prouidence gouernment wiſdome high profound comprehended v content therof ſhew ſo ſaith one ſhal die distreſse ſhal die • aſe ſay ſhall ſee ſome day life ſhall nothing pine away great miſerie length die beeing wery liue longer bicauſe life time nothing trouble torment fat perfect health yea riche wealthy iob meeneth ſimilitude breaſts full milke bone full maree ſay beholde fat euerie way ſee diuerſitie cauſe thereof vnknown vnto v would ſay howe happeneth ſome ſo proſper ſpende whole life pleaſure eaſe ſome liue continuall payne meeneth ſhould ſee manifeſt reaſon thereof truth ſome god iudgements hath beene touched heere ſo well knowne vnto v would open eye wee might well marke ſee cauſe god dealeth ſo men alwayes ſo god intendetd trie obedience holding eye cloſed ſo know reaſon worke blinde behalfe giue glorie confeſſe iuſte true although ſame bee manifeſt vnto v good try fayth ſeruice wee yeelde vnto contrarie part wee bee ſharpe witted ſuttle curious ſearching thing ſo allowe god rightuous vnleſſe ſhew v cauſe diueliſhe pryde therein wee declare ſelues ſubiecte vnto god force ſhall pleaſe v let v note iob heere ſpeaketh iudgements god yet hid v moſte parte bee▪ vvell muſt wee ſay caſe hee teache god knowledge▪ ſay hee ſhewe god office hee teach leſſon ſay muſt worke faſhion shall bee aſcende ſo high come infinit heigth wherein god ala great diſtance lifte vp ſelues ſo high god bring v downe well ynough ſhame confuſion appertaineth vnto diſcuſſe high matter shall walke aboue angel heauen vvee muſt humilitie reuerence ſecrets god incomprehenſible iudgements ſhall mortall man duſt aſhes take vpon ſearche knowe reaſon thereof muſt humble ſelues beholde iudgementes god ſhall ſeeme vnto v bee reaſonable yet let v learne content brydeling impriſoning myndes leaſt god ſhould bee diſguyſed v maieſtie glory trāfformed vve muſt acquaint ſelues ſay beholde thing conclude god doth according reaſon although ſeeme ſo owne eye haue already ſayde life god ſee whither confeſſe bee iuſt wiſe good although wee haue knowledge rightuouſneſſe▪ goodneſſe wiſedome true hee ſheweth v ſignes inough glorified v meane whyle leaue v ignoranthowe wherefore hee miniſtreth vnto v matter ſufficient gloriſie ye doth many thing wherein wee blinde men muſt vſurpe appertayneth vnto wit ſhould ſay▪ well may iudge according ſee yea prayſe thou oweſt vnto thy god thy maker wilte thou meaſure thyne owne capacitie thou arte nothing vvhat thy mynde vnderſtanding ſuch cōſtancie force whole glorie god encloſed cōpriſed doeſt thou heerein take much vpon thee therfore ſee thing world turned vpſide downe muſt let v knowe god diſpoſeth thing meete knoweth reaſons whiche hid v laſt day buried ſhall made manifeſt muſt ſuſpend iudgement till time truth may pray god make v perceiue wherefore hee doth afflicte v afflicted vvhen man ſuch payne findeth himſelfe great anguiſh miſerie may runne god ſay ala lorde thing ſhould ſeeme ſtraunge vnto therefore might leeſe paciēce aſsiſted thy goodneſſe euen wealth profite ſhould turne hurte confuſion although perceyue cauſe wherefore thou puniſheſt ſo yet muſt know wealth neuerth eleſſe voutſafe let vnderſtande ende thou doeſt afflict man eaſe muſt alſo bridle himſelfe pray vnto god would ſuffer abuſe benefite hee hath receyued ſay worthie men bee loued god dealeth ſort ſee great number men verie miſerable yet haue deſire token god verie well pleaſed let pryde arrogancie enter head leaſt tempted muſt pray vnto god make v vnderſtande wherefore ſpareth v vvee may deſire god hee would ſhewe v cauſe workes yea ſo farre forth expedient v wee muſt alſo come humilitie taking vpon v make god ſubiecte iudgement ſay muſt diſcloſe vnto v euerie poynt wherefore doth let v tarie paciently vntill declare vnto v knowe partly much atteine full knowledge god workes cauſes ſame vntill tranſſormed image wee haue life gotten ſome ſmall taſte goodneſſe rightuouſneſſe wiſedome ſuche pleaſeth communicate vnto v holy word teacheth v hee knoweth bee expedient v time let v cōtent ourſelues vvhich thing done vntill haue renounced curioſitie v deceiueable boldneſſe whervnto much inclined gyuen let v kepe ſenſence well remembrance ſaid▪ teach god dutis wee ſuch great doctours teach god leſſon controll men murmure ſo againſt prouidence god finde faulte muche would take hande teache god arrogancie creature whome nothing beaſtlyneſſe ignorance ſhoulde take vpon teache creator curſed monſtruouſneſſe againſt nature men doe ſo highly exalte themſelues gayneſay reply againſt workes god true wee thinke firſte yet murmuring replyes wee make miſly king wee haue whiche god doth contrarie iudgement appetite many blaſphemies tayle euil thought bee ſhort ſo euer content god prouidence yea humilitie confeſsing generally ſo euer proceedeth good rightuous ſame much lieth would pull god heauenly ſeate ſpoyle maieſtie ſet himſelfe roume place vvee make faire proteſtation meane ſuch thing thing ſelfe declareth otherwiſe ſhort oft tickled curioſitie ouer inquiſitiue heauenly matter meane ſeaſon haue ſuch boldneſſe mixt withal rage againſt god let v note muſt come cōpariſon art thou god thy creator doſt thou▪ ſet thy ſelfe againſt diſpute workes thou fellow preſumeſt thou do▪ haſt thou thing thee wherfore thou ſhouldeſt enter ſo deepe matter make thing ſubiecte thy iudgement vvhere art thou become wretched creature vvhen come compariſon muſtneedes worſe mad pride wherewith puffed vp bee quite throwne downe iob ment heere teach ſaying hee teach ment heere teach ſaying hee teach god knowledge furthermore bicauſe men ſo bold hardly brideled vnleſſe holden violence mā would ſay bound chaines ſaith yet ſhall god iudge high matter hee ſhould ſay well men vſurpe doth appertain vnto pleade againſt god ſhall get ende truely may alledge yet god ſhall bee diminiſhed let men exalte ſelues muche poſsibly yet ſhall god alwayes remayne place ſpite teeth hee ſhall onely remayne ſafe ſounde hee ſhall alſo ſit aboue iudge hygh matter ſhall leape like frogges shall flye aboue cloudes although wee wing flye ſo hygh yet angel farre glorious excellent yet angelles god fellowes equall contrariwiſe ſayde hide face wing wee haue ſeene ezechiell vnder figure cherubins angelles although bee great maieſtie nature neuertheleſſe beholde brightneſſe god conſtrayned hide ſelues glorie creator seing ſo noble excellent creature aſtoniſhed ſhould come neere vnto maieſtie god ſhal compariſon seeing god iudgeth high matter ſhall preſume exalt ſelues againſt vvell come ſo farre whatſoeuer ſhall throw againſt ſhall doe harme muſt returne owne confuſion much ſhould caſt ſtones ouer owne head muſt needes fall ageine vpon v yet ſhall able reach vnto god vvee might peraduenture ſtrike blowe hee onſide v ſeing aboue v yea ſo highe able reach vnto lift vp ſelues againſt much wee ſhould caſt ſtone highe haue ſayde muſt need fall againe vpon owne head ouerwhelme v happeneth make ſuch argumentes owne fantaſie diſpute god workes replie againſt deede throwe ſtones ſame muſt needes fall againe vpon themſelues ment ſayde ſhall daſhe againſt ſtone muſt needes bee bruſed broken yea ende ſtone ſhall fall vpon crouſe quite ouerwhelme thē let v note alſo god iudgeth high matter ſoueraine aboue creature doth ſet himſelf ſpecially againſt ſo highly eſteeme themſelues becommeth thē aboue degree ſayth hee mortall enemie proud let v learne ther ſuch ſo exalt thēſelues ſame muſt need turne ruine written humble himſelfe ſhall exalted contrariwiſe hee exalt himſelfe muſt brought nothing peculiar office god doe thing ſort let v note nothing better wiſe onely ſo farre foorth pleaſeth god inſtructe v let v knowe obey ſubmit ſelues vntoo thing true wiſdome thing come paſſe would wiſhe ſo caſily ſtirred vp enter ſome diſputation let v ſtay ſelues ſay yea god hath ſuch perfection nothing proceede good rightuous ought ſuffice v rule well fountaine thereof let v drawe boldly ſheweth v reaſon workes let v giue thankes humilitie receyue whatſoeuer hee teacheth v hee hide v let v bee content bee ignorant ſo farre foorth ſhall pleaſe knowing well hee reuealeth vnto v ſoeuer knoweth profitable v howſoeuer kepe v within certeine meaſure ende ſhould learne obey confeſſe hee iuſt although hee ſhewe v reaſon dooing ſumme haue learne place nowe ſhewe greatneſſe temptation ſayde afterwarde conered duſt wormes eate deede ſee like ende happeneth bōth although wee haue beene diuerſly delte withall worlde▪ might ſeeme god playeth iudge oure ſayth muſte ſurmount graues ſo euer wee beholde eye oftentymes taught v fayth ſight beholding thinges inuiſible vve ſhall ſee ſome good man ſhall haue ſerued god dayes life ſhall haue walked verie vprightly ſincerely neuertheleſſe hee ſhall bee continuall greefe paynes god ſhall ceaſſe ſende hym may tormentes euen death whiche alſo hee muſt goe pyning long tyme others ſhall runne headlong euill ſhall dye eaſe haue ſayde conſuſion thing ende come graue duſt conſume away woormes eate ſemeth toke paine ſerue god hath loſt labor behold gathered one heape good bad well thoſe haue liued heere great mirth pleaſure haue ſound nothing ſorrow trauell world vvhat ſhall ſay certaine ſhall amazed ſtay ourſelues vpon may ſeen eye vvhat done vve muſtaſcend higher knowe god reſerueth vntoo himſelfe iudgement appeereth preſently yea truely faith beholdeth thing inuiſible thing hid let v knowe although death like yet far diuers condition ſhal god ſhal declare time conuenient meane ſeaſon dutie walke alwayes feare conclude ſeeing hee iudge worlde iniquitie ſhall remaine vnpuniſhed haue taken paynes obey walke according rightuouſneſſe ſhal haue labored vaine diſappoynted expectation thus muſt conclude go ſtil forward ſee alſo god ment declare ſame vnto v mouth deceiuer although balaam endeuered ouerthrow truth turne lie yet god hilde racke forced ſay death rightuous wiſhed let death ſaith hee like vnto death rightuous ſaith head hee would much lay haue brought naught atd vtterly aboliſhed maieſtie god yet ſeeing god maketh ſpeake thus ſent angel heauen god ſay authorize doctrine peculiar marke conſtrein inforce wicked man enemie truth ſpeake wiſe wee haue learne wit muſt faſten eies vpon graue wee ſee brought vnto one heape difference betweene good bad betweene rich poore betweene thoſe haue liued eaſe thoſe haue alwayes bin ſorrow paine true death thing turned vpſidedown▪ god knoweth bring thing order perfect ſtate ſaid coming lord ieſus chriſt ſhall appeere iudge world ſhall reſtoring thing ſo ieſus chriſt ſhall come reſtore world followeth world day frame thing therin order meane ſeaſon let oure faith ſurmount theſe thing let v paciently abide till god finiſh work finde remedie nowe iob addeth furthermore thought went confounde vnknown vnto way vſed wrong hee ſhould ſay ſee whereto yetend yee ſuborned satan bring men diſpaire hold faſt hope haue god although ſo much oppreſſed poſsible man yet ſtill continue calling vpon hath promiſed ſauiour ſhal ouercome temptation thus doth iob arme defend himſelf againſt al obiected againſt friendes hee ſawe well ynough tended end purpoſe bring diſpaire nowe place conteineth profitable doctrine wee ſhould alwayes learne knowe ſubtilties satan goeth bring v diſpaire ſhould bee armed againſt haue wiſdome take heed malice men ſee go hurt v ſeeke vtter ruine deſtruction muſt wee much ſharpen wit ſpirites reſiſt satan prince iniquitie thing ought knowe men goe v harme muſt ſtand vpon garde conſider force ſtrength enemy cā ouercome force muſt fall pollicie ſee man go beguile v wicked ſlight beware well inough ſayth saint paule fighting againſt fleſh bloud ſay haue deale men nothing haue deale ſpirituall enemy principality behold satan vttereth force wee haue fight againſt diuels ayre winde v inuiron v ſides haue firie dartes wherewith wee ſhould bee ſtricken downe incontinently wee well furniſhed armed poynts therefore ſtandeth v hand watchfull cace aboue thing bee acquainted satan wyles according alſo sainte paule ſpeaketh another place wee haue marke ſtreine namely foraſmuch iob fenced againſt temptation put thoſe diuell ſtirred vp againſt ſee men go leade v deſtruction muſt haue eye open eſpie ſlightes may prouide diſappoynt haue aduiſedneſſe reſpecte men let v much haue reſpect satan cheefe enemie whome haue cheefely reſiſt may repulſe practizes deuiſes whiche attempt againſt vs▪ herevpon let v mark excuſes taken v bee ſurpriſed temptation whereof euerie man ought take heed wee ſteppe awrye euerye v alledge ſome meanes hee ſeduced ſome man finally wee put ſame thing vre ſhewed v father adam hee ſayde woman thou gaueſtme hath deceyued yea lorde hath giuen v diſcretion ynough ſobeit wee finde heartes watchefull bee wittingly rocked aſleepe muſte sathan needes ſnarle ſnare make wander well worthy yes ſeeme willing breake owne neckes haue ſought pittes fall well eaſe find meanes ſtart way many ſeeke ſtumbling blockes afterward ſay oh beholde ſuch one hath beguiled kepte watch god warneth v wee ſhould alwayes preſerued daungers wherewith ſnared thus ye ſee wee haue marke vpon place immediatly iob ſayth inquire go way denie ſignes ſtreyne expounded diuers wayes take theſe iourneyers wayfaring men allegoricall ſenſe faythfull bycauſe bee pilgrimes worlde haue reſting place muche ſtreyned vnderſtande iob ment ſaye heere freendes tooke wayfarer ſaye vnknowne man hee ſhoulde ſaye yee handle mee worſe would doe wayfarer vnknowne man otherſome take faſhion let v holde v playne meening whiche iob meeneth ſaye heere friendes leaſtwyze thoſe bare name come vnto vnder pretence ſounde vncorrupted iudgement would haue vſed ſuch ſlaunders againſt ſaying yea aske wayfaring menne thing whereof yee haue hithertoo reaſoned euerie one tell bycauſe yll mynded much theyr heades bee forepoſſeſſed cruell iudgemente ſpeake truth thing behooueth v bee likewiſe moderated ſumme whiche hee ment ſaye nowe wee taught nothing ſo contrarie reaſon truthe euill affection man ſhall haue nouriſhed conceyued within hymſelfe hee ſhall bee ſo blynded therewyth hee ſhall bee able diſcerne anye lyght ſhall bee vntoo alwayes darkeneſſe maye helpe v muche wee applye oure vſe behoueth v vvherefore vvee ſee howe euerie man letteth looce bridle affection vvhen iudge thing haue wee reſpect vnto reaſon bee guided ſurely affection ſo rule v ſee nothing bycauſe wee occupied ſome fantaſie one caried away pryde hee turne whatſoeuer happen man aduertiſe hearken reaſon ſo euer man ſhal vſe vnto ſhal preuail nothing vvhē man ſo hardned againſt god equitie thinketh could get better eſtimation remayne ſtubborne ende againe poyſoned ſome hatred diſpite wherevpon hee iudge raſhly hauing power inquire whither thing bee ſo foraſmuch vice reigneth ſo v doth preuail ſo much ought note place ſayd euen wayfaring men ſhall teach v ſay iudge thing firſt ſight paſsing way ſhal better vpright iudges ſhall bee forepoſſeſſed euill affection hinder thē iudging aright according truth iob ment ſay place nowe addeth end cōclude matter hath hand wicked reſerued day destruction ſuche men ſhall bee trayned day wrath meane ſhould run headlong raſh iudgement god puniſheth ſinnes men ſo ſone thinke good afflicteth good men holdeth vnder many tormentes trouble let v ſay yet wicked reſerued day wee worde reſerued yeſterdaye handled well printed mynds would meane kepe v feare ſhould ſo much caried away ſeeing trouble diſorders life wee finde heart reſerue thing vnto god think bring matter paſſe day morrow ſhall come time cauſe thing peruerted haue mind encumbered againe ſpeake ſo haſtily vnaduiſedly meane ſeaſon giue place vnto faith knowe god rightuouſneſſe experience teacheth v mean exclude whole worde god ſay helpeth v beleue nothing therin conteined beleeue owne eye much ſeparate ſelues god eſtrange v ſchoole ſcholers maruelled men become ſo madde man good diuel poſſeſſeth carieth cleane away ſee many ſuch nowe adayes muſt maruell iuſt iudgement muche muſt wee marke doctrine ſayde wicked reſerued day deſtruction breef ſee wicked eaſe proſperitie triumph true choſen muſt tempted haue ſome griefe inwardly ſo thinke thus ſelues howe meeneth god ydle heauen ſeemeth aſleepe careth thing beneath might indeede ſuch fantaſies come oure heades wee muſt beate backe ſay well lorde thou teacheſt ſhould looke vpon worlde firſt ſight would ſeeme vnto v thou aſleepe yet clean contrarie much ſee another iudgement vpon wicked vnknowne vnto v muſt alſo know euerlaſting reſt godly god giueth v alreadie declaration rightuouſneſſe iudgement reſerued thing ſhall bee reduced good order thus muſt wee take ſome profite example eye therefore thing come paſſe wee woulde haue ſo wicked triumphe god maketh countenance puniſhe contrariwiſe good tormented wee perceyue ſuccoured holpen many iniuries violence committed againſt meane ſeaſon god putteth hand prouide let v run ſaid vnto v wel another iudgement wicked reſerued deſtruction aſmuch wicked day ſpared let v note vengeance ſhal ſo much horrible market nothing amēded condemnation augmented euery day time dearely bought haue ſo mocked goodneſſe god haue abuſed wiſedome continued ſtill euill yea hardened therein exerciſed malice againſt good men child god faithfull ought reioyce midſt ſadneſſe ſee wicked ſo reſerued day deſtruction true time wicked ſhal world paradiſe ſhall always ſo life ſhort frayle muſt needes come account ſhall bee caſt teeth haue mocked god diſpiſed maieſtie ſhall become horrible vengeance ſhall bee prepared let v conceiue ſuch horror finall ſtate condition wicked wee may ſtayed companying leaſt ſpotted vice infection wrapped togither wrath god furthermore oppreſſed ſee godly men trouble anguiſh vvell let v knowe true life miſerable ſight make v go forwarde pricking ſpurre encourage v ſtirre v vp beholding heauenly life whyleſt wee labour come vnto wee might contemne deſpiſe thoſe thing wherin wicked wont delight place whole felicitie heere world nowe end iob ſayth iudge face againſt ſhall pay hath done ſeemeth firſt ſight hee ſpeaketh heere god ſpoken rather wicked neuertheleſſe tendeth approue iuſtice god ſhewe wicked although haue eſcaped handes men ſhall fayle come heuenly iudge ſum iob ment ſay although wicked haue ſo paſſed life man durſt ſet himſelfe againſte whyleſt liued ſeemed exalted vp cloudes yet ſhall fayle come graue true according man iudgement ſame might alwayes bee alledged proofe temptation howe vve ſee equall iob heere concludeth againſt enemy although ſight men ende like yet iudgement god aboue men muſte become ſo brutiſhe ſtay themſelues onely vpon graue vpon thing ſeene heere muſt know god ſhal ſo reſtore thing gotes ſhall ſeparated lambes god ſhall declare himſelf bee iudge whole worlde time yet come compariſon iob maketh heere nowe againe hee repeateth ſayde ſay man diſcerne betweene outwarde appeerance man glad grauelly ground bodie maye bee buryed therein one death laid togither graue beholde ſtate condition mankynde ſaid pſalme bring graue body great little old yong go like flockes ſheepe graue outward ſight diſcerne iudgementes god wherefore ſaith iob thus bycauſe mindeth make confuſion good profitable child god haue alredy declared armed long time againſt tēptations might happen vnto ſee ende godly wicked concerning outward appeerance like end themſelues afflicted might call vpon god knowing ſtate condition poore miſerable world ioy prepared hope whereof may well diminiſhe mitigate heauineſſe trouble might happen vnto world good mē ſhould know temptation may happen vnto thē true muſt herein haſtie ſo whē heare mention made deliuerance god ſend v aduerſities wee begin replie yea ſhall muſt ſtay vpon ſuch fantaſies muſt generally learne pacient thing leaſt fall head long fleeing fantaſies conceyue mindes thing god haue yet remaine vnknowne v let v leaue iudgement vntill reueale vnto v let v know perfectly doth ſuch thing cannot preſently comprehende cauſe iob ſheweth go graue brought thither ende ſhould gather thus well true death like wee put difference betweene godly wicked salomon ſayeth booke preacher liuing dogge better dead lion death man like death dog inaſmuch bodie man ſhall rot well carkaſſe beaſt vve ſee theſe thing yet muſt ſtay let v beholde ſhewed v mirrour god worde wit greater iudgement god reſerueth execute ſhall ſhewe himſelfe bee iudge whole world thus behoueth v knowe temptation haue known muſt reſiſt go forward let v ſo foliſh ſay oh whoſoeuer ſhall find proſperitie world let enioy deth hope contrariwiſe muſt ſay haue aduerſitie world let v know better hope layd vp v whervnto god calleth v haue proſperitie world let v thanke let v put confidence proſperitie may taken v betwene morrow ſpecially abuſe ſame thus ſay muſt wey thing preſent thinke ſelues iudge according man iudgement al ſhall done order ende fayth might preuaile v woorde god might guide v ſo may candle ſhew v way midſt darkeneſſe world vntill come heauenly brightneſſe wher ther ſhal knowledge part perfection time ſhal behold god face face let v fall face god acknowledgement fault deſiring make v haue better feeling wee may touched ſo may diſpleaſed ende wee may inioy grace promiſed v name lorde ieſus chriſte oure ſinnes paſſed bee forgiuen v would pleaſe guide v holie ſpirit ſo may alwayes aſpire perfection heauenly rich calleth v rid imperfection infirmity man may clothed heauenly glorie hath bene purchaſed v bloud sauiour ieſus chriſt may pleaſe c lxxxiij sermon first vpon xxij chapter eliphas themanite anſvvered ſayde 2 shall man profitable vnto god vviſe man profiteth himſelfe 3 vvhat careth almightie thou bee rightuous vvhat ſhall hee gaine thou vvalke vprightly 4 god afeard reproue thee come vvith thee iudgement 5 thy vvickedneſſe great thine iniquity infinite 6 thou haſt takē pledge thy brother vvithout cauſe thou haſt ſpoiled vvas naked 7 thou haſt giuen vvater drinke vvas thirſt haſt denied breade vvas hungrie 8 mightie man earth poſſeſsion vvas authoritie dvvelt wee haue doe men wee charge aduerſarie anye thing fynde anye thing reproue wee thinke wee haue halfe obteyned matter yea ſay ſelues faulte needeth iudge condemne v owne conſcience man accuſe mee finde ſelfe culpable ſeeke finde thing mee ſnatch alledge myne owne diſcharge ſo mee thinketh ſhould ſo muche diuert turne away myndes ſhould bee iudges cauſe ende ſhould wholy ſtay vpon euill haue committed might darkned wrapped vp common practiſe therefore wee vſe one another ſeeke ſome ſtarting hole ſame muſt ſerue v ſhift matter ſay haue done ſuch pleaſure man haue afterward offended ſame ought layd ballance thus wee would diminiſh fault wee haue committed elſe alledge thus though haue offended behalfe man altogither innocent come god theſe thing fal groūd true wee would vſe ſame talke god mortall men deceyued charge withall finde blame worthy ſeruice wee alledge wee haue done ſay beholding bounden vnto v mouth muſt needes ſtopped ſo doo confeſſe debt humilitie acknowledge condemnation bee iuſt without making replie without attempting law ſhall get nothyng thereby argument handled eliphas ſo ſee talke hee hathe may gathered good leſſon hee ſpoken verye well applyed ſame ſhould dyd well applying vnto iob wherein deceiued yet doctrine ſelfe generally profitable v wit god doth ſummon v ſtirreth v vp acknowledge ou • e fault booteth ſeke reply ſay haue offended behalf god ought pardon behold haue ſerued ſuch thing ought acknowledge ſame deſerueth well good turn • ▪ let v remoue al theſe toyes take place appeare god wee bring gayne made neyther hote cold ſay v good ſo alſo wee doo hym harme concluded agreed wee ſee preſumption muſt bee throwne downe v remedie humilitie acknowledge condemnation iuſt end ſame may better vnderſtanded let v debate thing order heere conteyned vverein ſayth eliphas ſhall man profit god wiſe man profiteth himſelfe true firſt ſight think deſerue much god hand wee indeuor oure ſelues ſerue honor much blynded heerein imagin god might receiue ſome commoditie v though neede v contrariwiſe neither increaſe diminiſhe hee ſuch ſort fountayne goodneſſe borow nothing another man whiche men bryng vnto releeue neceſsitie augmente wi • e neede ſayeth woulde come vnto thee creature hand furthermore wee knowe god ſeeketh nothing without hys owne maieſtie let v put away fooliſh fantaſie bring commoditie profit vnto god rather let v confeſſe dauid xvj pſalme goodneſſe ſhall reach vnto let men enforce themſelues much yet god receyue nothing hand whereby might bee ſayde fareth better yea god ſhould beſtow many benefites vpon v would deſire yet could make recompence ſayde cxvj pſal vvhat ſhall giue vnto lord ſo many thing haue receyued nothing call vpon hys name farre able make god bounden vnto v ſhall haue beſtowed vpon v benefites may wee able gyue like againe neyther ſeruice thus much concerning firſte thing wee haue heere note man would aske queſtion wherefore dothe god require v wee ſhould diligent ſerue ſeemeth hee hathe ſome reſpect himſelfe conſideration v ſaluation god hath reſpect hys owne profite giueth v rule good liuing commaundeth v abſtayne euill requireth v god whole lawe hath conſideration owne profite conſidereth good v expedient ſaluation let v well ſame ſhall returne vnto ſelues let v euill ſame ſhall returne oure owne loſſe hinderance god hee remayneth alwayes ſafe ſound true much lieth v offend maieſtie aboliſh iuſtice guiltie thereof yet bee ſayd wee diminiſh anyething god robbe whiche hath reach vnto iniurie truly therefore man ſhall hurt none hymſelfe likewiſe profite commeth returneth owne perſone heerein wee ſee ineſtimable goodneſſe god hee commaundeth v diligently declareth vnto v ſhould liue doth ſo bycauſe would play good husband ſay ſhall take ſome profite thereby ſurely bycauſe procureth oure welth ſaluation ſhould ſerue without reſpect mine owne profite ſo carefull ſome man benefite ſhould go ſollicite ſaying muſt euening morning pricke ſtirre hym foreward ſet ſome order hys affayres profite ſhoulde redound vnto ſelfe token rare ſingular loue euen ſo doth oure god deale v yet vvhen perceiue infinite maieſtie conſider vouch ſafeth thinke vpon ſaluation ſo carefull muſt needes touched quicke yea rauiſhed aſtoniſhed ſuch bountifulneſſe vnthankfulneſſe men ſeeing whereas god win nothing become ſo hardharted dull hee ſheweth way ſaluation exhorteth come vnto vouchſafe go one foote forward rather go backeward excuſe wee bee ſo vnthankfull bountifulneſſe oure god yet another thing namely although god receiue nothing v yet pretendeth bound vnto v haue neede ſayeth thing ye bring mee receyue nothing v true neuertheleſſe god accepteth doings maketh accounte though ſome value according ſee likeneth himſelf husband man hath vineyard hath cauſed dreſſed gathereth wine hath feelde reapeth corne god vſing ſuch ſimilitudes declareth hee ſo account work vnto pleaſant ſweete ſacrifices alſo ſayeth good poore euen hym accepteth done vnto himſelfe euen oure ſauiour ieſus chriſt himſelfe ſpeaketh ſaying whatſoeuer ye ſhall one leaſt mēbers accept bin done mine owne perſone seing god abaſeth himſelfe ſo farre make hymſelfe ſubiect ſtate condition mortall corruptible man ſayeth receiueth whatſoeuer vnto brother although bring nothing willingly bindeth himſelfe vnto v dept part ſee muſt needes rauiſhed admiration ſo great gentleneſſe god vſeth towards v let v note well ſayd place man ſhal haue taken paynes leade godly vpright life according commaundements god bee ſayd life hath profited god thing hath done himſelfe good yet god encourage v well accept thing whereby taketh profite requireth though hee better declareth ſhall leeſe oure labour thereby neither ſhal thing vnprofitable v ſay intent god incourageth v leade good life furthermore let v knowe end ſpoken vntoo v place wee muſt keepe remembrance circumſtance haue ſpoken wit come make account god muſt forget al theſe fooliſh imagination conceiue bring ſuche gayne ſhould deſerue ought hand let al thys ſay throwne downe hee creature needeth ayde help hee ſtandeth neede nothing content hymſelfe foraſmuch god manner meanes bounden vnto v let v learne humble ſelues let v ſorie ſinnes yea euen ſo may bee vtterly aſhamed deſire god forgiue v ſhould forgiue v ſaye hee knoweth haue indeuered ſelfe leade good life haue done thing ſo alledge surely nothing therefore let v forget theſe delayes acknowledge ſelues guiltie wee haue vſed theſe replyes yet reache vntoo god vvhen wee haue doo mortall men vſe ſuch flouriſhes couer fault withal yet maruelouſly aſhamed happen oure lie doo appeare vvhat ſhall become v wee come god heerein ſee papiſts deceyued although denye daunger god curſe would vſe extremitie towards yet alledge ſatisfactions therein play marchants god ſo haue made default one poynt make amends another away yea haue workes call work ſepererogation god neuer commanded theſe ſerue fill vp hole haue committed euill wherewith god doth vrge vvell ſay haue ſinned heere ſhall make amends yea matter tried ballance yet would ſome ouerplus poynt papiſts come thinke great abſurditie forgiueneſſe ſinnes ſhuld franke free god ſhould pardon v meere goodneſſe eaſily graunt true concerning treſpas concerning puniſhmēt perteyneth vnto v redeeme vvhē men caried away ſuch pride muſt ſay haue quite transformed god know maner one much muſt note wel conteined heere wit ſhall eaſily perſuade ſelues god ſomething profited v meere folly vayne fancie ſo ſhall haue conceyued high let v learne acknowledge fault al humilitie make replye lay nothing charge neither alledge vnto hath receyued thing hand nother thing boundē vnto v thus much one poynt ſayd moreuer god careth whither well ill whither walke vprightly vvhen eliphas ſpeaketh thus meneth god ſhetteth eye difference good ill hee meeneth himſelfe forceth true god fountayne al iuſtice right loueth equitie lead vpright life become wee image god certeyne haue goodnes ſelues ſee ſun ſhineth heere beneath caſteth foorth beames brightneſſe ſee heere beneath commeth earthe ſee brightneſſe vpō houſes vpon earth yet proceedeth thence brightneſſe reflected call returneth agayne earth receyueth reſteth vpon earth behold ſelues glaſſe glaſſe hathe face face man preſenteth itſelfe glaſſe repreſenteth backe agayne wee well ourſelues nothing drawen v al filthineſſe beggerie corrupted nature lord poureth goodneſſe rightuouſneſſe vpon v hee ſhew v fauor regenerating v holy ſpirit liue holily wee glaſſes whiche image repreſented brightneſſe whiche commeth aboue ſheweth itſelf heere beneth much god acknowledgeth al good come cauſe loueth good impoſſible ſhould otherwiſe ſeing welſpring fountaine thereof otherwiſe forceth reſpect himſelfe ſay profit aduantage receyueth therby careth mē liue vvhen men worſt ſhal therby take away rightuouſneſſe god diminiſh maieſty aboliſh glory honor ſhorten bound kingdom ſenſe ſayd god careth men concerning v let v cōſider felicitie ſubmit ourſelues vnto yeeld ſelues obedient ſubiects ſeing hauing need v neither life work yet ſo carefull ſhould lead godly life let v hereby know loue beareth v hath alredy bin ſaid doth voutſafe ioyne v vnto ſo vnite v liue wel ſayth kingdom eſtabliſhed liue yll ſayth raigneth wee ſo hinder god ſoueraine dominiō ſhuld remaine vnto euer thē doth vſe ſuch maner ſpeach haue already ſayd declare vnto v loueth v ſaid eightenth chapter prouerbes wiſedome god brought ſaying pleaſure delight dwell among mē god ſpeaketh thus declare vnto v wil keepe goodneſſe ſhet vp concealed himſelf wil poure amōgſt v may partaker taketh ſuch pleaſure ſo lighten v end ſhould brue beaſts know cōceyue teacheth v ſuch ſort might lifted vp high kingdome ſame maner dealeth al thing delighteth beſtow hys benefites vpō v giue v ſuch fruition ioyneth himſelf vnto v v vnto god thē carefull ouer v wee ſhould leade good life hath profite harme therby ſūme haue note ſaid moreouer feare thee bee reproue thee go lawe thee heere ſhewed v yet playnely ſhall get nothing ſeekingdelayes god wont fellowes mate cauſe men vſe ſo much cauilling controuerſies debate haue men defende thēſelues appaiſe partie elſe make afeard hee ſhould proſecute matter ſuch rigour example vvhen man aſſaulted wil conſider man purſueth liuely ſhall hee vſe ſome way ſcape elſe ſet ſome one hys aduerſaries tayle put flea eare ſaye thinkeſt thou thine aduerſarie ſtrong thee elſe ſtirre vp againſt hym ſomething vnder ground ſo man draweth backe waxeth cold dareth proſecute matter hee begon feareth leaſt miſcheefe ſhould fall vpon head bicauſe wont make mortall men afeard end might eſcape handes ſhew teeth giue ſignes wee haue wayes meanes auenged think able like god folly muſt needes voyd ſenſe iudgemēt bicauſe men ſo arrogant think practiſe ſame thing god neighbor therefore ſayde thinkeſt thou god holdeth hys peace feare thee cauſe moueth men put aduerſaries ſo feare bycauſe conſider man would iniurie muſt ſtay hym although ſet vpon giue repulſe elſe wil find ſome meanes law repreſſe thing ſtayeth v troubling one another purpoſe defend ſelues wicked ſeeke anoy v wee haue law ſetteth itſelfe betwene party make refuge ſtayeth executing purpoſed thus proceede wee haue wyth mortal men let v thinke god ledde ſuch affection wee vnto hym make hote cold haue ſayd god doth purſue v feare leaſt ſhould preuent ſet foote vpō throte would blow vpon v muſt needes bee ouerthrowne ſo riſe vp againſte god doo breake theyr neckes muche man ſhoulde breake hys ſinewes veynes while laboureth go vp high hee muſt needes miſſe purpoſe force himſelfe beyond meaſure ſhall breake bruſe whole body deadly fall happeneth men come diueliſh pride lift vp themſelues againſt god vve muſt thinke god afeard v hee mocke ſuch ouerweening ſayde ſecond pſalme vvel true men make much ado conſpire togyther ſpecially king prince confederate ioyne togither agaynſt liuing god people alſo agree make muche adoo beneath mē graſhoppers prophet eſay ſpeaketh graſhoppers haue ſo lōg legges leap muſt needes fall agayne keepe great ſturre heere leape aboue clowdes meane ſeaſon dwelleth high place wyll laugh skorne ſerueth ſhew god ſeat wit aboue heauens ſo men neuer reache vntoo hee ſhall aboue reſt laugh skorne while ſhal make heere much ado let v learne god doth cite v appeare layeth matter charge able hurt reſpect hath himſelfe ſtay v leaſt ſhould preuent giue onſet vpon firſt ſurely vvherfore make v feele euill v myght therby ſtirred vp ſeeke ſome remedie true repentance come vnto gouerned according god therefore hee puniſheth men ſeeketh health condemning mindeth acquite thē elſe chaſtiſed hee mindeth ratifie confirme iuſtice ſhewe euill ſhall remayne vnpuniſhed withall alſo hee intendeth abate men pride delight ſinnes glorye therin god wil bring al thoſe thing bringeth iudgement ſo let v learne flatter ourſelues wee haue remorſe inwardlye condemned word god men ſhewe v oure faultes rubbe v galled backe lette v learne ſay vſe ſtartingholes ſhall nothing elſe marre market wee may bee ſure god afeard v though could harme hee ſtirreth v vp feeling oure ſinnes wee might bee diſpleaſed thys meanes hee reacheth hys hande vntoo v leade v ſaluation elſe hee mindeth double condemnation wee may bee ſo much vnexcuſable reſiſt beſide naughtineſſe v alſo become ſo wilfull ſtubborn bow goeth bring v back vnto ſumme haue cō ſider eliphas addeth moreouer thy malice gret thine iniquity infinite truly yll applyed perſon iob hath bin already noted meane ſeaſon muſt holde v generall doctrine ende wee may apply ſelues▪ needefull v let v note mouthe rude man ſuch wiſedome ought haue apt applying truth vſe holy ghoſt doth ſhew v haue wee come recken god namely know euery point guiltie meanes bounde vnto hym nothing bound vnto v furthermore alſo harme bringeth v law condemneth v owne profite saluatīon wealth yea let v aſſure ſelues euen condemned end might afterward acquit hym leaſt ſhould fall condemnation whereintoo wicked ſhall conſtreyned come end ſide let v knowe god bringeth v thus iudgement examine oure ſinnes ſearch whole life end ſhould diſpleaſed ſinnes meane ſeaſon ſhal haue ripped vp v thinke knowe let v vnderſtand haue yet perceyued hundred part ſpeake euen haue cleare ſight flatter themſelues foſter euill howſoeuer much men dul haue ſhort dimme ſight certayne ſhall perceyue hundreth part ſinnes god hath farre cleare ſight wee haue knoweth fall ſinne day manifeſtly conuicted thereof committe another morrow morning yea day ſhall paſſe without great number offence tranſgreſsions euer new begin agayne wee ſhall conuinced one fault two three hundred ſo ſhal become v vvhē man hath well examined cōſcience findeth himſelfe ſo many wayes guiltie cōcludeth god knoweth yet hundred time wher become therevpon muſt need aſtonied muſt heares ſtand vpright vpon head plū ged bottome death thus much haue note vpon place wit oft hearing word god preached vyces wherewith ſpotted condemned euery man muſt enter himſelfe make owne proceſſe tarie till god proſecute law againſt ſay within himſelfe ala haue offended wiſe twice ſo many time haue offended wiſe ther diuers way ſo god would turne vp filthineſſe thing would ſhould vtterly vndone ſay would bring v humilitie repentance ſo wee ſhould bee ſo ſlacke wee haue bin approch vnto god leaſt wee ſhould ſo ſtubborne ſtriue againſt hys correction yea let v ſo much carefull thus bycauſe ſee moſt part men delight glory ſinnes ſhould ſigh grone▪ vtterly aſhamed counted good chriſtians yea perfecteſt may found deede ſay generally man men muſt confeſſe themſelues ſinners yet none dothe better know none hath better lyue well ſay thus filthy naughtypackes yea ſo filthy ayre ſtinketh theyr wickedneſſe yet cace make playne mocke god haue ſayd wee examine oureſelues well ſhall remayne vnto v nothing vtter confuſion inſomuche wee muſt needes acknowledge ſelues guiltie one ſinne two▪ throughly wholy knowing wee accurſed god moſt miſerable hath pitie compaſsion v breefe heere taught men muſte confeſſe themſelues ſinners god lightly faſhion ſake doo thinke ynough ſay oh denie ſome faultes muſt ſo muſt make burthen ſo heauie beare indeede ſo ſhall god truly glorified whych men ſay haue ſome ſmall infirmity imperfection whē dauid ſpeake greatneſſe ſinnes multitude iniquity daniell ſpeaketh confeſsion angel compariſon men yet ſayeth haue confeſſed ſinnes ſinnes people hee ſpeaketh ſome ſmall fault ſayeth ſinnes lord great outrageous ſo let v learne acknowledge wee yea ſuch ſort god may truly glorified throughly whole thus muche one point hope may haue god receiue v fauourable mercifull vnto v ouerwhelmed oure ſinnes wee haue committed lord ieſus ſayth come vnto ye ſay ſinner infirmity ſayeth ſo ye loden wearie whoſe ſhoulders bend vnder weight ſinnes theſe called ieſus chriſte ende may find mercie grace ſo mocke god making light confeſsion beyng touched hart haue note vppon worde furthermore come ſuche knowledge muſt particularly examine ſinnes wee haue committed man ſhall neuer truly ſay throwne bottome hell vnleſſe hee bee well ſearched haue conſidered ſinnes marked well one another vnleſſe wee thus particularly examine ſelues ſhall neuer perceyue iniquity infinite innumerable cauſe matter heere couched order eliphas hath pronounced generall termes ſinne iob great iniquity infinite ſayeth hast thou ſpoyled naked hast thou taken pledge without cauſe haſt thou withdrawne bread hungred hast thou denyed hym water drinke thirst meane ſeaſon waſt thou confederate men full violence cauſe god dothe nowe perſecute thee true haue already ſayde eliphas doth iob great iniurie wrong meane ſeaſon ſpirite god intendeth heere teach v order whiche wee muſte keepe truly humbled god leaſt wee become hard harted meanes prouoke vengeance ſtriuing againſt breefe let v note men ſhall neuer feele thēſelues ſinners ought except doo particularly conſider themſelues afterwarde enter account parcelmeale true wee neuer make ende wee muſt alwayes conclude dauid vvho vnderſtande hys faultes yet wee maye therefore ſay thyngs muſte bee paſſed ouer lightly bee ſearched ground earthly iudge bee ſharpe witted attentiue heare proceſſe life one man muſt praye wee haue offended oure god haue therein greater care yea proceſſe criminall onely ſome ſmall ſumme money yet muſt iudge looke neerely ſee whether bee witneſſes whether proceſſe haue proceeded aright thing verified yet controuerſie ſhall bee ten twentie florens hundred crownes ſome tryfle iudge doo duetie hee muſte needes bee counted guiltie god theefe worſe theefe ſeeyng ſtealeth man goodes ſubſtance apperteyneth one gyueth vnto another god dooth ſo farre honour v make v iudges owne liues yea doth ſaluation ſhall pray excuſed negligent cloſe vp eye ſo good profitable v certayne wee ſhall let v wey well whiche haue touched wit men ſhall neuer truly knowe themſelues ſinners ought requiſite vntill haue examined liues particularly indeede ſee dauid vſeth matter one fault onely bringeth middes ſea ſeeth hee hath committed ſo heynous offence god cauſe cruell murther onely one man many whyles went kill vrias therefore ſaw wickedneſſe hys ſinne enormitie thereof conſtrayneth onely thinke vpon fault alone alſo conſider hymſelfe neerely yea behold himſelfe mids sea condemne himſelfe vtterly thus alſo muſt therefore popiſh ſhrift diueliſh thing▪ would haue men ſhriue thēſelues prieſts eare ſpew ſinnes drunkard ſhould go ſpew wine hee hathe taken ſomuch hys ſtomacke able beare god haue v make ſuch confeſsion cleane contrarie repugnant hys word ſide alſo hee wyll haue v ſaye one word haue offended paſſe ouer coales lightly prouerb heere countrey cōſider ourſelues neere hand euery man enter hys owne conſcience acknowledge thus well onely giltie god one fault alone ſuch fault ſuch fault onely one tyme ſtill fall agayne vvhen examine ourſelues thus ſuche ſpeciall ſorte wee may well conclude lorde iniquity infinite oure tranſgreſsions innumerable thys wherein god bee glorifyed thus muſte poore ſinners bee touched quicke wounded conſcience maye bee diſpleaſed ſinnes deede confeſſe themſelues generall termes ſaye ſinner men well declare bee touched inwardly bottome hart cannot tell know ſinnes diſpleaſed v let v learne ſearche ſinnes euen bottome wee haue gathered number let v knowe hundred time let v aſhamed ourſelues acknowledge condēnation ſighing god ſaying ala lorde true ſinnes many number iniquity infinite lette multitude thy mercy poured vppon v dauid ſpeaketh way obteyne forgiueneſſe ſinnes pleaſeth god couer goodneſſe away clenſe v thē power holy ſpirit let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes deſiring make v haue better feeling wee haue ſide make v beholde holy maieſtie end beeing quite throwen downe may raiſed vp againe none meanes mercie grace hee hath ſhewed v lord ieſus chriſt meane ſeaſon lette v come yeeld ourſelues great ſauiour calleth v vnto reward v crowne glorye hauing reſpect ſo many miſeries v ſhal al ſay god moſt mighty heauēly father c lxxxiiij sermon ſecond vpon xxij chapter sermon doth proſecute expoſition ſixth ſeuen eyght verſes afterward texte beere adioyned 9 thou haſt let vvidovves go emptie arme fatherleſſe hath bin broken 10 therefore ſnares compaſſe thee ſo day ne feare doth trouble thee 11 darkneſſe maketh thou canſt ſee great vvaters couer thee man mighte maruell cauſe eliphas accuſeth iob ſuch crime neuer found ſhall ſee heereafter iob bin courteouſe liberall man dayes life hee proteſteth hath bin defender fatherleſſe protectour widowes eye blind legges lame hand neuer cloſed needie vvherefore doth eliphas accuſe haue taken away goodes ſubſtance neighbour violence pitifull bin cruell mā hee deuoured goodes himſelfe alone ſeemeth theſe thing reaſon wee muſt note eliphas iudgeth perſon iob affliction cauſe hee miſtaketh thing wee haue ſhewed muſt beware god puniſheth man wee conclude therevpon hee wicked man handled according deſerts ſetting cart horſe prouerb ſayeth euen ſo dealeth eliphas therefore iudgement corrupted furthermore hee heere propoundeth muſte ſimply vnderſtanded much ſhould exhorte iob well conſider whole life ſeeyng hee ſo afflicted ſtraunge faſhion hee ſhould conclude bin wicked man offence ſo outrageouſe god powred horrible vengeance vppon hee ſhould ſay ſee time thy proſperitie thou haſt beene cruell looke thou haue conſtreyned poore men euill thing conſider thou haue denyed ayde required thee vvay thy ſelfe whyther thou haue bin contemner god ſeeyng nowe thou remayneſt yet wilte iuſtify thy ſelfe token thou makeſt playne mocke god time thee humble thy ſelfe neuer ſeing thou art thus throwen downe muſt thou needes acknowledge thy iudge condemne thy ſelfe thou ſtill continueſt minde fight agaynſte god muſt needes therefore conclude thou arte mocker ſcorner thus doth eliphas heere proceede heereby ſee thing iudge ſo raſhly conſider neyther whych good men vertues god hath placed wee vſe trifling light coniectures coloure ſhew eliphas euer ſeene iob thyng whych heere layeth charge ſurely iob doth afterwarde declare vvhy doth eliphas thus reproue hym bycauſe ſoreincombered fooliſh fantaſie ſeeing iob greeuouſly puniſhed god muſte needes hath committed ſome crime yea god hath vtterly reiected euill concluſion eliphas maketh god ſometimes puniſh ſeruants according faultes haue committed trie pacience beſide ſhew deale ſo greene tree ſhall become whiche drie furthermore intendeth mortify concerning world teach miſeries wee ſuffer thys world ſhall hinderance bleſſedneſſe promiſed v though bee hidden ſhewed world vve ſee god hath many cauſes afflict conclude therevppon afflicting led curſed wicked life next way peruertal yet thing behind worſe enter fooliſh coniectures man hath bin men ſight man good conuerſation ſhall find cauſe wherefore hath deſerued ſo delt withall giueth v occaſion dreame dote elphas doth heere vvherefore muſt bee ſober refrayne ſelues go giue iudgement vpon neighbour therefore let v go aduentures let v examine well theyr life know man wicked perſon deſpiſer god ſo fault notoriouſe wee may well ſay god puniſheth end ſhould taught example ſame might profitable leſſon v beſides whē perceyue man cauſe god ſhoulde puniſh ſeuerely calamitie happen vnto let v ſtay iudgemente practiſe whiche heere alledged pſalme let v rather pitifull inclined good part thinke al lord would deale v according deſerts ſhuld become v better man yea may ſay worſe yet wee ſee plaged let v learne god leade v farther ſheweth v life nothing moreouer hee intendeth exerciſe diuers battels ſhall haue ſhewed themſelues pacient mids affliction wil haue comfort themſelues know better reſt prepared another place thus muſt thys cace procede let v particularly examine touched heere eliphas ſayth thou haſt taken gage thy neighboure without cauſe thou haſt ſpoyled naked heere ſee ſinnes ceaſſe bee odious ſight god although men condemne v man ſo cruell take pledge ſome poore man hee lendeth neede hee take either couerlet bed coate wherwith ſhould clothed man ſue law ſhould ſued hee ſhould acquited hath lent money lawfull take pledge aſſurance men hee meanes conſtreyned muſt therfore thinke acquited god therefore wee thynke perſwade ſelues iuſt innocent god bycauſe wee haue bene reproued men wee deceyued worldly policie ſerueth bring v perfection god requireth v hys child ſufficient ſo maynteyned euery mā may inioy right ſtrongeſt carrie away deceit extorcion iniuries outrage bee puniſhed purpoſe ſhould worldly policie ſerue wee come god ynough v alledge haue bin theefe led galowes bee whipped haue murthered mā ſhuld condēned death haue committed crime bringeth eyther bodily puniſhment infamie vvhen wee ſhall haue alledged purpoſe haue borne neighboure ſecret grudge alreadye accounted murtherer god haue attempted corrupt abuſe another man wife haue looked hir vnchaſtly lo condemned whoremō ger couet man goodes ſeeke drawe vnto although men caſt teethe yet taken theefe god vve may thē place gather profitable doctrine may flatter ourſelues men cannot charge v whole life haue bin ſued lawe anye miſdeedes ſhort though men may iudge v righteouſe may yet muſt thinke ſcaped cauſe hee ſhall haue taken pledge aſſurance money counted god ſometime murtherer heere ſayd expreſſely take pledge without cauſe ſimply thing euill itſelfe neither doth god vtterly reiect wit man ſhuld take pledge lawfull bie another man goodes lawfull take pledge beholde feeld medow layde pledge whiche thing god doth condemne likewiſe bring ſome parte mouables ſame itſelfe ought vtterly bee reiected ſayd euill take pledge without cauſe eliphas addeth mind ſo neede ſeeke gloſe ſaith iob hathe taken pledge neighboure hee hath ſpoyled naked according lord declareth law namely pledge whych wee take ſhould ſerueth man ordinarie neede man ſpoyled bee colde ſo cruell take coate ſame kinde murther man forgoe bed releefe hys hunger lay couerlet pledge corne thing neceſſary ſuſtenance taketh vnkind ſo farfoorth lieth killeth changeth kind death aſmuch man danger hanged owne handes vntie rope ſtead wil cut throte whē poore man ſhal haue nothing eate ſhall conſtrayned giue away bed get meate villanouſe crueltie ſuch meanes excuſed therefore lord ſaith lawe take heede pledge poore man remayne thee night vvhen thou ſeeſt ſame ſerueth neceſſary vſe cannot without muſt ſuſtayne harme reſtore agayne thou let poore man haue hys bed agayne releeue neceſsitie ſides ſhall bliſſe thee thou haue reſtored vnto garment ſo cold body ſhal bliſſe thee contrariwiſe poore man put bed diſeaſed thy wickedneſſe thou haſt bin ſo vngentle thou wouldeſt lēd nothing without pledge although poore man doo cry vengeance hee dumb yet ſhalt thou accurſed neceſsitie ſhal ſufficient call thee accompt iudgemente ſeate god mind eliphas yea ſaythe thou haſt ſpoyled naked ſaye poore man came vnto thee required borrow money thee thou diddeſt conſider thou tookeſt pledge whether gaue thee cote bed pot panne ſo whē bread knew eate thou haſt takē hym thing whereof ſtoode great neede vve ſee walke ſincerely god liue togyther brethrē ynough v keepe earthly lawes nothing againſt worldly policie muſt aſcend higher muſt keepe equitie nature nothing man whiche would men ſhould v therefore let euery man conſider well woulde men ſhuld ſay wold iudge ſtand equitie like neede nowe none ſay well ſhould wee oure lord commaundeth v cheriſh one another hungrie danger alſo cold pulleth coate backe doth declare ſeeketh nothing elſe cut throte alledge reaſon well ourſelues wee like another ſhall neede iudge ourſelues condemne v breefe ſumme muſt learne place nowe foloweth afterward thou hast giuen water drinke athirst thou hast withdrawne thy breade hungrie heere eliphas ſheweth mighte iob puniſhed god bin ſo pitifull towardes men releeue neede may gather ſome frute doctrine muſt leaue perſon iob wee haue touched therefore let euery man conſider himſelfe god viſiteth v dealeth v ſo rigorouſly ſo compelled feele ſinnes ſay let v examine matter well whether bycauſe wee haue ſhewed ſuch courteſie towardes oure neighbour commaunded v ought ſhewe heere ſaid ſtoppeth eares poore crieth vnto hym requireth aide hand ſhall crie hymſelfe ſhall bee hearde beholde god threatneth v wee wyll voutſafe helpe require ayde oure handes wee haue power meanes ſuffer v fall intoo ſome miſcheefe yea richeſt thoſe lyue moſt eaſe god hathe hys hande manye roddes chaſtize v withall firſt conceiue truth whyche riche hope ſhall neuer fall intoo perplexitie thinke although trouble confuſion ſhoulde happen whole worlde yet ſhoulde remayne peace oure lorde declareth whiche helpe theyr neyghbours neede make accounte ſhall come intoo theyr place ſhall bee holpen neyther ſhall releeue ſhall bee hearde aboue fle • vnto god gate ſhall bee ſhut vntoo ſayde ſhall bee iudgemente withoute mercye woulde ſhewe mercie moſte horrible threatning bee vſed againſt v god declareth vnto v hee deale v without mercie wee looke god haue mercie pitie vppon v wee muſt needes bee ſwallowed vp vndoutedly god depriueth v barreth v hope hys goodneſſe bee ſo cruell towardes oure neighboures therefore god viſite v oure affliction bee greate let v learne ſearche diligently cauſe wherefore examine matter thus goto haue meanes helpe thoſe ſtoode neede worldly goodes haue holpen haue diſcharged duetie heerein neede helpe haue indeuered ſelfe helpe came vntoo ready communicate goodes vnto hym know haue done duetie thys behalfe let v ſigh god know ſheweth v great fauoure put v remembrance fault furthermore let v note theſe fonde fooliſh ſtartingholes ſay vvhat ſhould leaue ſelfe bare mine owne goodes whiche god hathe giuen mine owne diſpoſe thereof muche ſhall ſeeme good vnto haue goodes haue ſtolne man wrong heerein ſhuld lawfull inioy hold god giue thankes acknowledging gyuen hym ſay wee wyll thinke wel done alledge al althogh lord giue vnto riche whiche poſſeſſe though haue lawfull meane ſuche ſorte proteſt haue yet followeth may vſe ſuche ſorte ſhoulde haue regarde vnto neceſsitie another man ſhould lightly god beſtoweth rich vpon v abundantly doth v honoure make v ſtewardes receyuers ſee receiuer hathe onely charge receyue heape vp goodes alſo diſtribute maiſter commandeth seeing lorde appointeth v ſtewards goodes whiche hee putteth handes hee alſo haue v diſtribute vve know hath neede v disburſe would haue v help neighbour thoſe ſtand neede therefore haue abundance welth muſt alledge mine owne yea ſo indeede howbeit wyth condition thou ſhouldeſt help thoſe ſtande neede thereof thou ſhouldeſt deuoure thy ſelfe alone god hathe giuen thee ende truth lawe bee made thys behalfe ſainct paule declareth prince ſhoulde leuie ſubſidie require ſome quantitie goodes euery man poſſeſſeth therevppon muſt ceſſement made god doth vſe ſuche proceeding hee loueth thoſe offer vntoo theyr meere liberalitie ſaint paule ſayth cheerefull hart rich muſt giue vntoo poore neceſsitie conſtraint free franke hart therefore neighbour bee hungrie thirſtie wee knowing neceſsitie releeue excuſed haue deuoured abuſed benefites god hathe put handes vvhen thus ſay certaine god count v giltie murtherers thus muche concerning verſe ſayde hee puniſhed god hathe denied gyue poore hungrie man bread hath gyuen water drinke thirſty added furthermore mightie man meane ſeaſon poſſeſſed earthe authoritie dwelt therein ſerueth ſhewe rich men haue compaſsion bycauſe lyue eaſe know ſtand neede knowe neceſsitie meeneth therefore touched therewith bee ſhorte full thinke world ſo well ſumme eliphas mynd thys place applyeth ſame perſon iob vpbraydeth earth made ſmall number men rich men thinke whiche haue neuer ynough dayly purchaſing ſaying thus themſelues thys would ſerue well purpoſe muſt needes get ſuch peece ground neede ſixe foote haue theyr full meaſure ſay ſhall bee buried hee hathe goodes ynough find hundred perſons yet aferd ſhould ſtarue hunger lyke vnſatiable whirlpooles woulde content themſelues hadde whole earthe poſſeſsion would coulde pull sunne skye greeueth poore ſhoulde haue ſo muche common wyth inioy brightneſſe ſunne thus theſe whirlpooles would deuoure thynke world made none eliphas reproueth heere ſuche vanitie according alſo worthy condemned howbeit hee dothe well applye ſame perſone iob yet doctrine profitable v let v vnderſtande man abuſe credite ceaſſe gather deceitfully bycauſe hee hath alwayes compaſſe hys matter bring paſſe vnſtaunched vnſatiable couetouſneſſe ſaythe haue ſuch thyng yet wind ſuche thing therefore nippeth pincheth euery ſide one hee would haue earth bee made hym alone thys meant heereby ſaying whyche haue authoritie earthe dwell therein true oure lord woulde ſhould gouernemente amiſſe bee riche men poore created god ſayth salomon ſo ſaying hee meeneth two thing witte rich ſhould deſpiſe pore much creature god poore condemne rich muche god would ſhould rich pouertie lawfull man haue rich poſſeſſion inioy whiche hee hath yet muſt hee know wee liue worlde condition vſe mutuall participation one another god doth giue habitation dwelling lyue owne alſo ſaith hee hath giuen earth inheritance men ſame ſpoken generally therefore although ſome world haue one foote lād yet muſt haue dwelling place worlde leaſtwiſe money haue yea euen ſtrange countrey bee natiue countrie god wil ſo trie thē rich dwell thē go driue thē far ſpreading wing abrode much angry god deſpite would take whole world hād haue note place profitable leſſon teach thē aduanced credite blinded pride abuſe authoritie wont mā rich let cōſider muſt therfore occupie whole earth authoritie muſt therfore deſpiſe poore eſtimation muſt ſupport one another ſo behaue themſelues rich may offer ſome meanes poore liue may get liuing honeſtly trauell aduātage let poore although haue nothing owne content himſelf ſeeing pleaſeth god make able get liuing without iniurie mē let ſo deale one another cōmon ſocietie may mainteined euery man nurriſhed ſuſteyned thus riche men warned deſpiſe poore ſo proudly wont poore alſo walke according degree ſmall habilitie men liue though lodged worlde hand god nurriſhed grace ſumme whiche taught place ſayd moreouer iob ſent away widdowes without ſuccour aid broken arme fatherleſſe ſay ſo throwen downe whereas poore fatherleſſe ſhoulde haue bin ſuccoured rather oppreſſed ſpecial mention made widowes fatherleſſe child bicauſe lord doth ſpecially cōmend haue leaſt ſuccour wife vnder ſhadow hir husband vnder protection ſo long ſhe hath aliue alſo come man ſtate alredy able mainteine himſelf poore widdow hath neither counſell meanes poore fatherleſſe child knoweth thing meane theſe therfore ready ſpoyled therfore lord would haue ſo much commended wont pleaſure looke recōpence contrariwiſe god intendeth proue charitie whither wee good able requite v beſides looke men oppreſſed muſt applie ſuch meanes god hath giuen v ſame ſeene widdowes fatherleſſe child therefore god hath cōmended vnto v ioyneth alſo ſtraungers bicauſe haue many kinsfolk alied lincked long traine friēds might mainteined much becōmeth child god haue pitie vpō ſuch perſons brief ſee god law throughout whole holy ſcriptures declareth himſelf greuouſly offended widdowes fatherleſſe child ſtraungers afflicted men hurt harmed bicauſe deſtitute ſuccour therfore ſo much muſt haue pitie bicauſe haue meanes requite v ſhew ſelues child god wee extend charitie alſo god doth acknowledge ſame putteth account therefore let v doubt much profitable ſo entreat ſtraungers widdowes fatherleſſe child men alredy recompenced v contrariwiſe vexe thoſe lie open ſo many iniuries adde euill vpon euil come accōpliſhment miſchief token voyde humaine iudgement become like vnto brute beaſts therfore eliphas reproue ſinne ſaith heere thou haſt reiected widdow ſuccoured hir thou haſt holpen fatherleſſe troden vnder foote ſhort let v aſſure ourſelues lord would haue weake ſupported thē haue beſt meanes moſt able wee ſo ſhew ourſelues child god wherevnto doth god looke wherin doth chiefly exerciſe mercie pitie vpon oppreſſed beare ſaid muſt reſemble heauenly father triall whereby ſhould ſhew called vaine child wee become like vnto know although god pitifull al creature although goodneſſe poured vpon men yet neuertheleſſe telleth v ſpecially regardeth troden vnder foote oppreſſed iniuries violence help defender fatherleſſe mainteine widdowes ſtrangers seing god declareth thus much behoueth v like vnto behalf contrarie token wee forſake god fauour hath ſhewed v choozing v child thus much wee haue note place let v come eliphas ſaith cauſe ſnares cōpaſſe thee euery ſide ſodaine feare maketh thee aſtoniſhed vve muſt alwayes remember hath bin declared afore namely miſapplied perſon iob therwithall let v beare mind generally alſo theſe thing laid eye end wee ſhould know miſeries calamity chaſtizements god layth vpon v ſinnes truth hath bin already ſaide god puniſh ſinnes men alike neuertheleſſe wee ſuffer thing wee thereby admoniſhed examine liues ſigh grone god acknowledging ſelues giltie maieſtie thus much one point furthermore although god purpoſe ſome end puniſhing ſinnes yet behoueth euery v conſider himſelf viſited god ſhut eies whē god doth ſhew v light time afflicted let v vnderſtand god hath laid ſnare v wild beaſts wee walked ſheepe fold would haue layd ſnares take v mā lay ſnares eawes weather beaſtes eaſily handled man needes whiſtle come wee would willingly come onely voice god ſhuld neede hunt v lay ſnares v ſo men wont wilde beaſts let v know god deale rigorouſly v haue rebelled againſt thervpon let v examine liues enquire whether wee haue offended moreouer whē ſuch feare cōmeth vpō v aſtonied therwith▪ bicauſe haue walked quietly obediēce god vnto thē peace promiſeth keep although beſeeged enimies although midds many dāgers yet ſhal alwaies ſafetie ſleepe quietly reſt vnder ſhadow therfore aſtonied feare let v vnderſtād god puniſheth v bicauſe haue ſimply walked vnder obedience ſhort euen peace ſingular gift god ſo trouble come vpon v curſes ſent frō ſaid peace ſingular gift god whē ſhal haue called vpon god true aſſurāce heare v requireth nothing elſe wee ſhould come vnto ineſtimable benefite ſuch treaſure neuer ſufficiently valued neither obtain ſame meanes faith know god father ſauiour ieſus chriſt vnderſtanded onely eternall ſaluation ſoules alſo world haue priuiledge run vnto god cōmend liues hand ſeeke needes neceſsities vvhen ſhall haue gotten peace wee ſtay ſelues vpon prouidence god caſt carcks care vpon ſingular benefite god hath beſtowed vpon v contrariwiſe troubled ſaid extreme curſe ſtate condition man moſt miſerable ſuch feare aſtoniſhmēt ſeeth nothing daū gers euery ſide yet cānot come vnto god find reſt aſſurance man ſuch feare already hell yes ſurely therefore let v aſſure ourſelues although thing come paſſe would wiſh yet haue peace nothing howbeit let v note alſo wee muſt ſeeke peace world wicked do▪ ſo lōg troubled moleſted perſwade maruellous thing themſelues triumph therevpon thing ſpite god withall vvee muſt haue peace proceedeth retchleſneſſe blockiſhneſſe ſo triūph worlde haue neuer peace forget god▪ curſed peace better v trouble might come vnto god ſeeke meanes reconciled vnto ſo paſt feeling let v note peace may liue eaſe muſt bee grounded god haue reſpect vnto meane ſeaſon let v knowe wee trouble god viſiteth v ſinnes yea alſo meanes calleth v vnto end ſhould ſeeke ſuch peace hath promiſed v frō deede eliphas ſheweth trouble whereof hee ſpeaketh feare wherwith iob thought ſeized could truſt goodneſſe fauour god profitable thing worthy noted may happen euen faithful ſhal great trouble anguiſhes altogither without feeling yet god ceaſſeth giue light vvhen ſee thēſelues cace deepe dungeōs yet haue alwaies ſome light god feele goodneſſe haue receiued ſome comfort leadeth ſtil forth ſo ſtaied vpon promiſe infallible briefe aſſault ſoeuer haue alwaies lift vp head looking ſaluation frō man ready drowned god reache hand behold though reſtored life againe looketh vp heauen wee haue light darkneſſe cōpaſſeth v euery ſide ſo perceiue goodneſſe god minded ſhew v fauour wofull cace therefore wee aſſured theſe ſpirituall battels muſt abide world ſo many feares trouble god ſendeth trie cōſtancie ſtedfaſtneſſe let v determine ſelues ſet eye vpon light ſheweth v ſay vpon promiſes maketh v conteyned word herken diligently vnto ſtay repoſe ſelues wholly vpon let v doubt giue v ſuch quiet reſt wee may ſay lord afeard euill although ſhould walke ſhadow death ſo bee vnder ſhadow thy wing thy protection
