nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes deſiring giue v ſuche knowledge may onely cauſe v confeſſe alſo hate bee diſpleaſed oure ſelues ſeeke meanes bee abſolued god beſeeching alſo ſo guide v holy ſpirite wholly ſubiection obedience may ſeeke nothing elſe yeeld ourſelues obediēt vnto much commaundeth v liue togither world brother let v continue brotherly vnitie hath conſecrated among v let euery man imploy himſelfe help neighbour end wee may vnfeynedly call vpon oure father hee may acknowledge auouche v child hath giuen v teſtimonie adoption hart holy ſpirite grace hath ſhewed v ſauiour ieſus chriſt may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c lxxxv sermon third vpon xxij chapter 12 god high heauen behold heigth ſtarres hovv high 13 yet thou • aiſt hovv ſhould god knovv iudge cloudes 14 cloud hide cā ſee nothing vvalketh circle heauen 15 haſt thou marked old vvay vvherein vvicked men haue vvalked 16 vvhich vvere throvvne dovvne time foundatiō vvas riuer dried vp 17 ſayd vnto god depart v vvhat almightie vnto v ſaw eliphas wrōgfully accuſe iob though hee liued wickedly among men perceiuing iob acknowledge condemnation true addeth deſpizer god deede men fall ſuch extremitie giuen euil corrected hand god doo returne rather ſo much hardned therfore ſcourges god cānot tame v token vtterly paſt hope recouerie true medicine bring v againe way ſaluation god ſhould ſhew v fault make v feele thē thē ſo kicke againſt hād god declare therby paſt amēdmēt diſeaſes incurable true ill attributed iob yet muſt follow order haue hitherto kept wit ſeeing doctrine good holy euery one v muſte take ſome profite let v firſt note hūble themſelues vnder hād god chaſtized aduerſitie declare haue religion faith aught elſe contempt god although haue bin ſo fooliſh ſtray way continue wicked life god wink v yet time amend neuer god doth viſite v conſtreyne v force god ſpeake vnto v ought ynough v whē ſtriketh v doth adde ſome help word bicauſe dull vpon ſpurre amend v ſhould man ſay child paſt grace haue firſt note concerning perſon iob ſeeing haue alredy declared ſhal ſee hereafter large ſuche perfection blamed ſuſteined ſuch reproche accuſed haue bin cruell man vniuſt dealer finally counted contemner deſpiſer god time men condemne v ſo wrongfully let v learne bee pacient god wil ſuffer v ſo blamed end may learne walke led away ambition hunt glory prayſe men content ourſelues conſciences quieted god vve know nature wee inclined ſuch fooliſh pride woulde praiſed goodneſſe v would world ſhould know man ſhould refuſe v nowe ſee heere ambition mixed inſomuch ynough v men eſteeme v pertneſſe may bee rayſed heere world meane ſeaſon god quite forgotten therefore profite lord ſuffereth men v wrong go well turne euill ſo wee blamed ſlandered tendeth profite end wee ſhould learne haue god iudge content ſelues alowed although whole worlde reiect v let v ſet light thinke hard let v ſet eies example iob farre paſſed v holyneſſe yet ſee wrongfully miſuſed done without god ende might learne leſſon haue ſpoken namely muſt ſeeke honoured men ought ſuffiſe v allowed god conſciences doo teſtifie vnto v hee dothe accept v let v come reaſons eliphas vſeth heere vvhat knoweſt thou god aboue behold heigth ſtarres high aſmuch eliphas accuſed iob vngodlineſſe cōtempt god vſeth exhortation leſtwiſe ſaith behold god deede meanes awake v whē falne aſleepe thinke ſinnes pride rebellion v onely thinke vpon god ſame ſufficient bring v againe reaſon while wee remayne heere world conceiue ſuch fleſhly aſſurance care nothing maruell ſee nothing neere v trouble v conſidering already ſelues full pride vvell muſt come god behold maieſtie thē ſpite teeth wee muſte learne caſt downe head reuerence infinite highneſſe therefore order eliphas keepeth good ought obſerue rule oft touched ſinnes thinke vppon vengeance god drunken pleaſures bee briefe delight miſchiefe cannot bee brought repentaunce remedy thinke thus ourſelues vvell iudge whome muſt render account mortall creature ala come conceiue incomprehenſible maieſtie ineſtimable highneſſe god wee muſte needes bee ſo abaſhed humble ſelues puffed vp minde eliphas god ſaieth high heauen vvhy doth thus ſpeake ſeate god diſcerne creature thing worlde truth god infinite eſſence incloſed heauens maieſtie ſpred whole worlde doth alſo fill earth declared heauens comprehend thee ſaide salomon dedicated temple god himſelfe prophet eſay ſaith heauen royall throne earth footeſtoole god encloſed heauen yet without cauſe ſcripture ſpeaketh ſo heauen ſuche marke maieſtie glory lift vp eye thither wee muſt needes bee moued therewith lette v behold earth heere beneath true workes god ſeene ſtirre v vp magnifie howbeit aſmuch touched ſuch reuerence whē haue walked beneath looke vp heauen bycauſe marke print maieſtie glory god let v think ſtrange holy ſcripture whē intēdeth moue v honor god ſaith vnto v aboue heauen deede ſhould ſaid vnto v god world aſmuchas carnall wit alway way bending downwards would faſtē piller houſe moūtain elſe would ſet ouer head eares ſome riuer ſuch fanſies mé end wee thinke vpon god wee might learn imagine earthly thing paſſe beyōd world ſtay owne ſenſes fantaſies ſaid god dwelleth heauens end ſhould know lieth power incloſe world conceiue wee neuer cōprehend ſenſes haue ſmall meaſure rather ſhould learne reuerence al humilitie cauſe ſaide god aboue heauen ſame well knowne vnto v certain al ſuperſtition would eaſily redreſſed deed ſprong men would cōprehend god according capacitie whereas able hold alwaies ſenſes would faine occupied ſearching curiouſly god thervpon forge conceiue ſuch one ſeemeth beſt thē though god carnal cauſe draweth v ſo carefully thence ſheweth v muſt imagine nothing think good blaſphemy ſacrilege ſo tranſforme turne truth lie paul ſpeaketh al forge idol transform god according brain falſaries falſifying publike writing matter record aboliſhing maieſtie god ſuche heinous treaſon againſt god paſſeth therefore build ſuch foliſh fantaſies according appetite giltie ſuch treſon much ought remēber wel leſſon taught v wit god aboue end oft ſpeake may know ſeſes ſhal faile v vaniſh away hundred time come highnes muſt worſhip hū bly conceiuing nothing el hath taught v word al wiſdome haue ſaide doctrine well printed hart world ſhuld purged al ſuperſtitiōs haue alwaies reigned hapneth men haue ſo forged idol thought god nigh except ſome remēbrāce ſay figure men toke leaue cōprehend god thinke nothing ſo foū tain al ſuperſtitiō men thus make viſible ſhapes bicauſe knew highneſſe god incōprehēſible maieſtie taught whē people iſrael requiring haue ſome viſible ſigne repreſent god ſaith wee haue go v ſay haue ſubiect vnto v howbeit wee muſte ſo preace vnto god haue ſaide wee muſt reuerence humilitie furthermore men thought ſerue god owne faſhion framed lawes themſelues ſaying good ſuch thing acceptable vnto god bicauſe would make like vnto thēſelues though delited ſmal toy inuēted wit outward thing ſo trāsformed god though would pull heauēly ſeat draw hither though creature fleſhly thing wee ſee theſe fonde deuotions vſed papacie termed diuine ſeruice ſprāg namely knew highneſſe god wold haue cōcluded thus god delited thing ſeeme good eies another nature ſpirit therfore muſt ſerue clean contrary faſhiō vnto pleaſeth nature nother muſt wee cace preſume attempt thing head haue law hath declared vnto v hath preſcribed v rule let v hold v vnto ſobrietie god▪ requireth worde whervnto would haue v ſubmit ourſelues without ſwaruing thing al therefrō herevpon eliphas ſaith behold height ſtarres high according haue already ſayd wit foraſmuch creature beneath doo moue v ſufficiently feare reuerence god ſhould behold skie thē liuely touched true villanouſe vnthankfulnes yea wāt ſenſes moued honour god though opened eye cō ſider thing lie feete doth earth bring forth ſo many fruit ſtrength foode receiue thēce cōmeth nature diſpoſition therfore although mā ſhould loke farther foot certain open eye ſhal conuinced god ought worſhip aſmuch dull groſſe headed doth greatly moue v vvhat muſt helpe ſuch rudeneſſe infirmitie let v looke vpon high muſt need brute beaſts moued ſighte skie order ſeene ſtarres ſo goodly exquiſite diſpoſition doth ſufficiently teſtifie vnto v wōderful maieſtie god men muſt needes aſtonied behold skie furthermore ſith wee know ſunne ſtarres ſo noble excellēt creature thervpon let v ad taught v heere wit god aboue cānot reach vnto vvhē know muſt needes rauiſhed much greater admiratiō ſee heathen men whiche taught moued idolatry beholding sun moone starres ſaw ſuch glory dignity thought ſhuld haue done great wrong iniurie ſun ſhould haue worſhipped god certain men cace otherwiſe haue better direction yet ſay heathen • therfore excuſed haue conceiued sun moone creature yea euē liueleſſe creature haue feling yet hauing ſcripture law bee taught could touched glory highnes appered ſun moone reaſon wherof moued worſhip thē make idol thē error ſhal ſerue condēnatiō another maner ſeing god ſpeaketh vnto v declareth himſelf ſo fully giue v record maieſtie ſheweth v way come vnto therewithall doth offer v autētick ſeales ſun moone ratifie thing vnto v ſpoken mouth ther ſee proofe effect pray ſhal dubble gilty conſideratiō moue v make v worſhip great god incomprehenſible maieſty humble ſelues vnder ſame ſumme haue learne place let v come eliphas caſteth iobs teeth namely thinke god marketh thing beneath chargeth vngodlineſſe ſay god walketh circkle heauen cloud ſtop vnto ſo ſeeth ſtate mē gouerne thing eliphas doth lay faſly vnto iobs charge ſeene wicked men worlde aſmuch perceyue god heere neere vnto conclude ſo farre may ſport themſelues though ſawe nomore like theſe blinde wretch haue viſible ſhape god thinke themſelues vtterly vndone god among papiſts ſee crucifixe may mow vppon ſee marmoſets ſay vvhere god become skill religiō know chriſtianitie meeneth pray vnto god vnleſſe haue marmoſets may kneele downe blocke ſtone ſo heathen alwayes wont ſee heathen rayled law moyſes ſaid iewes worſhipped cloudes vncertaine ſecrete godhead bycauſe looked vp heauenward image forge themſelues god owne deſire wretched papiſts proceede ſame manner day altogither like heathen impoſsible mē ſhould otherwiſe vntill ſuch time god declare vnto another meane neere vntoo nowe meane doo theſe wicked men haue deuotion thinke oh god aboue glory careth thing beneath buſie himſelfe meddle neither thing perteining vnto comely maieſtie thus wicked take occaſion eſtraunge themſelues god giue themſelues libertie miſchiefe ſaying god ſeeth wee muſt note thing well wee bee ſtayde hande god worde doth ſtande v ſtead bridle vvee ſhould fall like confuſion lord doth declare vnto v dwelleth high hee beholdeth thing heere beneath nothing hid vvell wee thereby admoniſhed walke face hath declared ſo much vnto v yea worketh alſo v holy ſpirite openeth eye end wee ſhould thinke vpon maieſtie oure deedes thought greater confirmation hee addeth woord preached vnto v two edged ſword ſo examineth thought affection proceedeth euen vntoo maree bone ſayd epiſtle hebrues ſhort god declareth vnto v hath giuen ſuch property word ſame ſtayth v ſuch bridle ſhould become v let v note well ſentence ſaid wicked vnder ſhadow perceiue god naturall witte thinke ſcaped hand triumph willingly perſwade themſelues god careth anything done heere beneath nothing cōfuſion thing ſame commeth vntoo knowledge concerning heere ſayd cloud cloudes couert vnto god true howbeit farre ſenſe scripture ſpeaketh vnto v maieſtie god ſaith deede hid cloud purpoſe ſaith ſo end ſhould curiouſly gad aſtray wont ſee men ſo tickliſh nothing ſpeake god diſpute purpoſe reaſon without modeſtie ſaying yea reaſon god ſeemeth ſpeake companion ſome one inferiour vnto vvee ſee ſuch diueliſh boldneſſe men enter deepeſt ſecretes god turne vp thing leaue nothing vnremoued ſhort god muſt ſubiect vnto see whereto come cauſe holy scripture ſaith vnto v god hath darke cloudes place hide himſelfe wherto ſaith ſo mocke phantaſticalneſſe v purchace vnto god vvill wee comprehend ſecrets let v come cloudes yet come ſtarres great way behold one cloude doth ſo lette v wee cannot ſee ſunne although brightneſſe come vnto v yet know place vvhē sunne ſhineth noone dayes bee cloſe raynie weather cannot marke place sunne ſay ſuch place cloude let v wee cannot ſee creature whiche ſheweth himſelfe dayly pray ſhall comprehend god thē holy scripture mocketh ſuche pride men enquire beyond meaſure apperteineth vnto diſpute god pleaſure ſo diſcouer leaue nothing hid cloude ſaith ſcripture yea ſeeth reſpect v cannot comprehend cloude letteth v ſenſes weake cauſe saint paule ſaith place haue alledged men vaniſh away owne imagination vvhat ment ſaying vaniſh men haue wandred way way fade away ſmoke euen point god behalfe hath ſo cleere ſighte hee paſſe cloudes world ſo ſhall nothing darke vnto cauſe ſayd dwelleth vnapprochable light ſaying notable god cannot knowne v ſeeing nothing brightneſſe woord vnapprochable importeth wee cannot come neere man lift vp himſelfe ſhall go meane lift vp himſelf pride preſumption ſay tell god comprehend liſt deede diueliſh ouerweening haue ſaid mā attaine brightneſſe god againe nothing v pouertie weakeneſſe vnabilitie men ſelues cannot approch vnto god muſt approche vnto v muſt conceiue ſuch doth offer himſelf word contenting ſelues cōteined ſayd although way ſuch wee cannot come vnto god yet dwelleth brightneſſe ſay eye blinded ſeeth knoweth thing vnderſtand cloude couert god hide himſelf yea ſo men cannot come vnto yet couert reſpect himſelfe ſo mā might ſay gouerneth thing prouidence ſeeth plainly onely done beneath alſo whatſoeuer men cō ceiue mind meane ſeaſon muſt note certaine men thinking honour god thereby haue imagined heere ſaide horrible blaſphemie thus while men honour god fantaſie marre al fooliſh men therefore haue thought meete god ſhould troubled v ſhoulde great derogation maieſtie thus gouerne thing vvhat ſay ſhall god carefull flie worme birde ayre proper thing deede thus while mē attribute vnto god ſuch honour ſeemeth good vnto themſelues ſpoyle power maieſtie vvhat muſt let v learne honor god requireth v let v hath bene already declared ſuch ſeruice wee haue forged owne brayne let v ſimply herken whiche god hath ſpoken declared himſelfe hath ſpoken owne holy mouth let v hold v reſolution let v know ſhall haue knowne god ſuch ſheweth himſelf holy ſcriptures may glorifie becōmeth v alſo due honor requireth alloweth ſayd scripture prouidence god mercie ſtretched euen vnto brute beaſts nothing ſuſteined hand power herein firſt declared vnto v power beſides ſee infinite goodneſſe carefull euē wormes earth birde ayre falleth ground without wil forſight ordinance behold goodneſſe god vouchſafeth haue care ſo vile deſpized thing wee alſo ſet ſo litle ſtore furthermore thereby wee may alſo conclude loue beareth v according reaſons proufes sauiour ieſus chriſt much worth litle ſparrowes nouriſhed heauē ly father thinke hath regard mainteine thinke alwaies vnder wing turneth al thing ſaluation thing hapneth vnto without good thus muſt honor god bringing ſubiectiō ſenſes fantaſie accepting declareth vnto v himſelf holy ſcripture ſo ſay god walketh circle heauē therfore medleth matter vnſeemely thing troubled humane earthly affaire wee ſpeake ſorte ſo god needeth take pleaſure idleneſſe beaſtly opinion conceiue god would ſhut world thinke al thing gouerned prouidēce power ſaying tuſh god ſuche glorie muſt bee aboue happie life muſte haue care thing much change god ſhape god haue already ſaid like vnto mortall mē place great part felicitie liuing eaſe reſt idleneſſe god troubled needeth breake braines thing trauayle hāds feete thing el gouerneth thing meanes doth remouing himſelf going cōming framing thing making great diſcourſes truly gouerneth mainteyneth al thing word alone ſuch ſtrēgth creature muſt needes obey know god doth walke aboue galeries filleth whole world muſt behold alwaies neere vnto v bicauſe behalf neare vnto wee muſt walke face knowing cannot go one foote beholdeth v al thing marked brief ſumme wee haue note vpon place eliphas asketh iob whither haue marked way elder become wicked ſayeth rooted broken ouerthrowne foundation ſay al ſtabilitie riuer rūne dried vp againe eliphas cōfirmeth ſaid afore wit frō beginning men haue knowne wicked bee puniſhed true god haue declared hath alwayes giuen ſome exā ples iudgemēts end men might kept feare according ſaying prophet eſay lord ſhal execute iudgemēts inhabitāts earth ſhall learne rightuouſneſſe therefore ſee lord ſtretcheth arme chaſtiſe wicked ſhe weth himſelfe iudge ought moue v feare loue god hath al time giuen ſome token men muſt needes come accompt iniquitie ſhall remaine vnpuniſhed yet doth puniſh thē offend alike therefore may make generall rule wicked puniſhed worlde needed reſerue iudgement latter day vvhat ſhould become immortalitie men ſoules ſhould become hope haue reſurrectiō ſhould come nothing eliphas marreth al maketh generall rule particular example god hath ſhewed thing wee haue note god hath puniſhed wicked lifted thēſelues vp againſt although ſame haue bene done yet muſt conclude although many wicked mē ſpared euen end haue lined al voluptuouſnes die minute houre without languiſhing yet muſt needes come accompt ſhall let v paciently tarie till hid frō v reueled brief ſumme wee haue note vpon place meane ſeaſon let v waigh word ſpoken heere wicked time may vaunt themſelues yea euen ſo farre raile againſt god thing deſpite eliphas reporteth ſay get thee v ahnigbtie vnto v vve ſhall ſee rage ſo furious wicked meanes knowe god thing ſpite withall though power authoritie ouer end god pull thē downe wel ynough meane ſeaſon eliphas vpbraydeth iob heere ſayde theſe menne miſſed haue houſes furniſhed good ſeemed vntoo iob ment denie prouidence god cleane contrarie confeſsion whiche iob made altogither ſuch ought hold ſay god ſpareth wicked ſeeme ſo happie nothing mocke religiō ſame remaineth vnpuniſhed neuertheleſſe muſt ſurmount ſuch temptation afrayd cōclude god iudge worlde ſhewe himſelfe ſuch one although preſently wee ſee lo right ſound confeſsion iob hath made miſtaken eliphas haue already declared theſe wordes wit wicked ſay vnto god get thee v ſo ſpeake flee knowledge much lieth willingly wittingly become brute beaſts ſeeme man ſpeake theſe ſcoffers whiche ſeeke nothing el take pleaſure man ſpeake vnto ſay iudgement god threaten therewith matter ſtirre vp choler yea lay power would haue whole holy scripture brēt men might neuer ſpeake wherfore euen male factour neuer would ſee neither gallows gibet iuſtice thing el ſhort would gouernment world wicked coulde finde heart deſtroy maieſtie god lay power meane ſeaſon refuſe doctrine ſtop eares blindfold eye might neyther ſee heare ſhorte withdraw themſelues much obedience god would meanes ſubiect therevnto alſo euen among ſelues ſee ſome counterfait great chriſtians contented ſay one word well muſt obey god woorde muſte preached yet would haue man tell tale wote neere ſo rubbe galled backe men proteſtation ſo euer make doo well declare ſeeke nothing elſe bee eſtranged god ſay vnto get thee v although vtter blaſphemie mouth yet men ſee well ynough minde vvell part let v learne walke god feare carefulneſſe much come neere vnto v let v pray ſo continue v wee may neuer eſtranged ſeyng worde ſo familiar among v doth dayly communicate ſame vnto v preaching holy goſpell let v beholde ſame deſire lift v vp aboue clowdes yea euen vnto heauen faith hee hath giuen v wee may increaſe ſame vntill haue fully ioyned v vnto himſelfe beholde perfitely hidde v fully faſhioned according image name lord ieſus chriſt let v fal afore face good god acknowledgement faultes deſiring make v ſo feele wee may learne diſpleaſed ſigh grone calamity affliction wee ſuffer eſpecially offence wee haue committed knowing good god layeth roddes vpon v drawe v ſuche knowledge ſinnes might make v ſory driue v aske forgiueneſſe ſame ſeeke remedie whiche hath promiſed running ſeeking ridde ſinnes ſhould coue • nothing pleaſe thing dedicate ſelues honor glorie praying ſo augment v grace holy ſpirite wee may conſtantly perſeuer obedience middeſt al ſtumblingblockes affliction may happen vnto v vntil haue gathered v heauenly reſt may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation earth c lxxxvj sermon fourth vpon xxij chapter sermon doth ſtill proſecute 15 16 17 verſes ſome part texte therevnto annexed 18 yet hathe hee filled houſes vvith treaſure lette intente vvicked bee farre mee 19 righteous ſhall ſee laugh innocent ſhall mocke 20 oure ſubſtaunce ſurely hathe bene hidden fyre hathe deuoured remnant 21 acquainte thy ſelfe vvith deale vvith peace thereby thou ſhalte haue proſperitie 22 receyue lavve mouth lay vp vvoordes thy heart wee beganne yeſterday declare end ſaying eliphas tendeth hee reproueth iob ſaying god ſuffereth wicked proſper puniſheth truth deed according iudgement worlde eliphas fellowes ſayd god doth neuer ſo delay iudgemēts appeare amongſt v againſt experience ſaying iob true wee muſt paciently abide till god ſet thing order againe ſhall bee done world vve muſt thē walke hope hope importeth ſo much wee ſhould haue ſight ſtayed vpon thing preſent although al thing order yet wee muſt quietly abide god pleaſure eliphas groundeth himſelf vpon point conſider courſe world ſhal ſee god hath al time puniſhed wicked true wee haue oftentimes ſayde god hath alwaies giuen ſome token iudgements keepe men awe ſo far hereof ſhould make generall rule ſame contrarie reaſon truth let v come againe hath bin alreadie begon handled eliphas ſpeaking wicked attributed vnto ſuch pride vtterly refuſe god wil haue come neere vtter ſuch woordes mouth bicauſe abyde god ſhould bring thē vnder ſubiection ſeene till ſuch time god hath tamed men holie ſpirite beare yoake euery man woulde haue libertie hee liſteth heere mencion made whiche haue bene hardened long time wearie good doctrine ſo hate would wiſhe might neuer heare wordes number ſuch men hath alwayes ben great day furthermore gone ſo far aſtray refuſe doctrine god al thing ſpite withal though could nothing againſt ſay almightie doo vnto v truth ſpue ſuch blaſphemie yet walke boldly like murderer ſo care threatning make mocke thing vntill hand god vrge conſtraine them▪ go ſtill wickedneſſe aſ much ſhoulde affirme cared thing god vnto ſo bee ſhort▪ ſee eliphas ment declare farre men paſſe bound haue continued miſchief become ſo diueliſh cā abide bee admoniſhed brought right way namely defie god though hee authoritie ouer thē onely place ſee ſo would god exāple therof eye let v note hath ben touched namely holy ghoſt ment ſhew v glaſſe whether men fall headlong long time noozeled ſins ſay ſuche brutiſh beaſtlineſſe runne head againſt god remorſe conſcience paule ſaith conſciēces rocked faſt ſleepe ſo make doubt thing ſerueth end ſhould walke feare pray vnto god ſuffer v come ſuch extremitie let v go foreward ſaying eliphas asketh iob whither haue marked way ſuch men whither hath taken good heede expound ſentence though eliphas reproched iob folowing faſhioning himſelf like vnto deceiued rather intendeth ſay iob man altogither without iudgement doubteth whither god puniſheth wicked ſeing hath alwaies perceiued doth herein deceiued hee ſaieth alwaies might haue well bene yet god hath ceaſſed reſerue many puniſhments vnto time come ouerthrew citie sodome others neere vnto hath done like al townes ſo giuē ouer euill truly ſend flud ouer al world yea yet ſee mē haue ceaſſed prouoke vengeance vpon yea muſt appoint law puniſh ſinnes alwaies alike deale pleaſeth muſt cōtent ſelues order taketh yea truly haue ſhewed reſerued puniſhments would ſeeme ſhould iudgemēt ſhould come accoūts al thing wer ſo perfectly reſtored worlde wiſhed thing miſlike thē would reſurrectiō therfore behoueth god vſe ſuch meanes onely giue v ſome exāples whereby may know ſinnes ſhall remayne vnpuniſhed whereas delayeth v holdeth v ſuſpence till latter day end wee ſhould fixe mindes beneth though thing alredy ſo accōpliſhed wiſhed brief ſumme eliphas mindeth ſay verſe haſt thou marked wayes worlde worde world ſignifieth ſometimes antiquitie ſhuld ſay▪ god beginneth puniſh wicked hiſtories old time ſhew v hath alwaies done ſo ſo long ago ſince sodome gomorrha periſhed ſo long ago ſince fludde know thou thē god hath brought world vnder rule deale men according deſerts▪ furthermore eliphas hauing ſpokē puniſhmēt deſpiſers god thoſe gone ſo far order mocked power doth yet aggrauate malice ſayeth neuertheleſſe god hath filled houſes treaſure men bound vnto god might wel excuſe thēſelues yeeld thēſelues ſubiect vnto excuſe taken away men guiltie ſuch vnthankfulneſſe muſt need remaine amazed hauing perceiued god faire meanes draweth thē vnto yet haue ſet thēſelues againſt would meanes abide ſhould winne thē ſee eliphas ment ſaying god filled houſes treaſure true men generally boūden vnto god aſmuch created placed worlde mainteyned god declareth himſelfe vnto man peculiarly done make ſo much inexcuſable howe thus man proſperitie god ſendeth thing would wiſhe ſame man hath leſſe cauſe murmure agaynſt god afflicted tormented many wayes riche menne thoſe liue ſo eaſe turne head againe play reſtie iades certaine ſame compted haynous offence without cauſe gentle handeling god hath thus ſhewed vnto ought ſoften heart although ſtubburne nature ſome fearceneſſe yet god intreated ſo gentily hee meant winne gentleneſſe seing ſo wilde offence doubled eliphas ment place therefore let v parte learne way aright grace god beſtoweth vpon v benefites whiche receyue hande vnto v many warning yeelde ſelues obedient ſo farre forth honour commit gouernement mayſterſhip ouer v handes bounde vnto mortall man although hee vſurpe authoritie ouer v handes wee bee bounde vnto mortall man although vſurpe authoritie ouer v yet wee take handes ſo bound wil ſay nature teacheth v much ſhall acknowledge ſelues boūden vnto god benefites hath beſtowed vpon v hath created faſhioned v maintayneth v ſo many wayes ſheweth himſelfe father vnto v yelde vnto owe therefore haue already touched let euery v looke well ſelfe conſider benefites god hathe beſtowed vpon ende may helpes vn v bring v obedience ſo may peaceably raigne ouer v guyde v meanes rebell agaynſte ſpecially god ſhall haue dealt ſo fauourablie v poured liberalitie vpon v let ſerue make v tractable vnto let v deſire god eſtraunge himſelf v ſhoulde become vs▪ ſhould think benefites haue receyue proceede nothing elſe god neere vnto v god v good thing coulde haue ſeing commeth ſtate condition men miſerable aſſay flee frō preſence god ſeeing ſeeke nothing miſchiefe vvherefore let v learne humble ſelues god ſhall haue filled v treaſures let v horſes fatte kick agaynſt mayſter god vpbraydeth iewes moyſes ſong let v like vnto horſes whiche well fed let v ſubmit ſelues vnder ſubiection god knowing although wee haue receyued great number good thing hande minute houre bring v pouertie haue made v fatte wee may ſhort ſpace become leane needeth blow vpon v behold wealth ſhal vaniſh away seeing ſo let v walke alwayes feare acknowledging good thing wee inioy come god homage ſame knowing wee could inioye pleaſed continue grace fauour towardes v thus rich ſhall happie bliſſed honour pleaſures ſuche like thing ſhall meanes make men drōke bring aſleepe rather make thē watchfull put thing god hand ſhould ſay lorde truthe hitherto thou haſt vſed ſuche goodneſſe towardes v wee haue liued eaſe thou ſhouldeſt turne away thy face behold vtterly vndon lord thou haſt maintayned v preſerued v vnto time let pleaſe thee ſo continue euen ende eliphas ſayth theſe deſtroyed time foundation riuer runne vvee ſhall ſee ſometime happen deſpiſers god whē haue hoped attayne vnto maruelous thing god ſhall throw downe ſhall bee diſapointed vayne hope ſhall haue conceyued vvee ſee yea although god ſuffer wicked liue die proſperitie purpoſe conſider preſent life pray continuance it▪ vve liue deede yet man ſhal alwayes ſuch holy scripture deſcribeth ſay hearbe greene aſſoone winde bloweth vpon withereth away aſſoone ſythe paſſeth ouer graſſe becommeth haye ſappe dried vp periſheth nedeth one broyling heate ſunne burnt vp knowing frailtie life ought thinke ſtrange bee compared riuer runne dried vp riuer whiche runneth ſuche wiſe ſome water ſhortly ſuche wee haue ſeene bee naturall thing eliphas ſpeaketh riuer ſo broken bankes afterward drieth vp hath courſe euen ſo fare wicked whiche become ſo bold thinke ſhall neuer fayle ſhall ſo waſted ſhall remayne one droppe ſtrength wee take ſentence according minde eliphas wee may gather good profitable doctrine place ſay although god puniſh wicked firſt euen life ſpareth yet ceaſſe like vnto riuer runneth ſoundneſſe them▪ yea ſhall periſh theyr time time bycauſe perſuade themſelues ſhal liue heere euer thinke thier felicitie ſhall continue alwayes god cutteth life laugheth ſcorne ſay ſoule fill thy ſelfe thinke ſhould ſwallow vp whole worlde ſhall ſtrawe breadth liues ende god throweth downe without cauſe ſayth periſh tyme diſapoynted hope promiſe themſelues long life god cutteth ſhorte ſayde man ſhoulde cutte threede weauers webbe ſeemeth threede ſhoulde go ſtill wee ſee weauers worke apace threde breaketh webbe ceaſeth happeneth lyfe man thinke go forward ſeemeth vnto v ſhall neuer haue ende wee become dronken ſelues beholde meane ſeaſon god cutteth threede let v minde doctrine ſo wee knowe ſhortneſſe lyfe wee may ſo conſider heauenly enheritance promiſed v expectation may bee ſettled knowing lay foundation worlde haue great ſureneſſe bicauſe builde vpon water ayre muſte vaniſhe away wee ſee god puniſheth preſumption buyld world put truſt thing preſent ſheweth thē nothing elſe buyld water ayre wee haue ſayd nothing kingdome heauē certaine vnchāgeable vve muſt grounded true ſtay scripture ſpeaketh brief note wee haue marke place wee may yet profit doctrine lette v way ſaying time wicked ſhall bee deſtroyed time bycauſe god taketh hence ſhould pul vp rootes force faſten themſelues vpō earth though ſhould neuer taken away take roote onely imagination wicked deſpiſers god ſhall take ſuch roote pryde ſhall thinke haue foundation hundreth foote deepe earth impoſsible ſhake yea god wil giue little fillup ſhal ouerthrowne roote imagined ſo without cauſe ſayeth wicked periſh tyme neuertheleſſe let v hold faſt hath bene ſhewed ſay time continue long perceyue god repreſſe wicked deſpiſers maieſtie let v therfore diſcouraged let v walke ſtill ſuffer god vſe libertie witte ſeeme good vnto let chaſtiſe wicked worlde let iudgement hidden v vntill wee come latter day thing ſhall diſcloſed eliphas ſayeth moreouer rightuous ſhall ſee laugh innocent ſhall make mocke ſeemeth firſt ſight cōuenient ſeing child god ought folow heauēly father vve know god inclined mercie pitie men mocke afflicted ſame without crueltie holy ghoſt attributeth ſuch affection childrē god mocke wicked ſee ſo throwne let v note firſt al behold iudgements god aright take ſome profite thereby muſt purged carnall affection muſt led deſire vengcāce moued exceſsiue paſsions wee wont muſte bee amēded v muſt haue pure cleere ſight behold doings god thus diſpoſed may without crueltie mocke wicked whē god deſtroyeth deede wee muſte like well iudgements god finding good wee muſte alſo reioyce bycauſe ſaluatiō thereby aduāced god thereby declareth loue hee beareth v let v learne god puniſheth ſinnes wicked wee haue matter reioyce yea wee muſte knowe wherefore two cauſes haue cauſe reioyce god thereby declareth himſelfe iudge glorie maieſty therby appeare lo matter reioyſing oft god ſheweth himſelfe giueth v ſome triall ſtrength power glorifie behoueth v reioyce greater ioy require preſence god ſhould thus draw neare vnto v ſecond cauſe god thereby declareth hath care ouer v ouer child whē puniſheth enemy thoſe troubled v delt outrageouſly v god thē chaſtiſing wicked doth ratify cōfirme loue beareth good faithfull mē againe ſecōd cauſe ioy yet wee muſt haue ſayd cleane purged deſire vengeance malice ſhort haue put al fleſh ſpirit god guydeth v ſhall haue right pure zeale reioyce fall wicked take ſome profite iudgements god yet one thing noted ſayd righteous ſhal mocke god ouerthroweth deſtroyeth ſame ment thoſe afflicted many whome god chaſtiſeth wealth whiche men altogither paſt amendment puniſheth body ende ſoules might periſh heere mention made reprobate vve know god hath vtterly reiected except ſhew vnto v sodome gomorrha thoſe deſtroyed floud wee haue certaine teſtimonie extreme vengeance god place repentance left thoſe wretched perſons bycauſe made themſelues vnworthie mercie theſe thē ſuch like may reioyce god ſhal chaſtiſe neighbour wee knowe yet whether wil haue pitie muſt haue cōpaſsion miſeries ſo moued iudgements god may conceyue hope ſend ſome releaſe ſo afflicted bee ſhorte thus muſte wee put texte practiſe true doctrine thus briefly touched might bee darke euery man note well whiche haue touched may afterwarde large thinke ſo thing thus briefly touched may neuertheleſſe content v firſt haue ſayd wee muſt vſe ſuch gentleneſſe towards neighbour wiſh health ſorie euils paule teacheth v rule charity requireth lamēt ſayth ſuffer ſee child god haue alwayes affectiō zeale yet ſee god puniſheth ſinnes may alſo reioyce yea much god therein declareth ſheweth himſelfe vnto v ſayth muſt bee ratified confirmed ſee hath care ouer mankind thing guyded followeth ſubſtance conſumed true worde worde ſubſtance bee conſumed bidden hebrue worde ſignifieth two thing properly ſignifieth hide bycauſe thing hid ſeene ſemeth quite gone likeneſſe betweene ſignifieth ſomtimes cut bring nothing furthermore ſeemeth ought haue ſayde ſubſtance deſtroyed referring ſame wicked deede place ſo tranſlated greekes wee beholde narrowly ſeemeth natiue ſenſe yet ſubſtance bidden let v note maner ſpeach muche vſed among hebrues whiche importeth greater affirmation ſayd yea certaine ſubſtance hid alſo worde substance importeth ſtate wee haue hande way preſerue v reſtore v ouerpaſſe expoſitions giue vpon place whiche doo agree let v ſimply hold eliphas meneth ſay maketh compariſon rightuous wicked faythfull deſpiſers god concerning faythfull ſayeth truth ſubſtance hidden hee vſeth worde de hee meaneth ſubſtance periſhed loſt contrariwiſe layd vp ſafetie treaſure commeth paſſe midſt ſo many danger wee yet remayne vpright vpholden wee vnder wing god ſhort ſecrete layd vp treaſure certain life euery minute houre ſhould takē frō v one way thē haue good doctrine whē ſhal thus vnderſtāded according ſenſe texte thus ſhall righteous ſay ſubſtāce ſtate ſay power mayntaine v preſerue v hidden left vnto wicked deuoured fyre ſay god leaueth nothing al ſomuch muſt needes deſtroyed wealth true mortal life may ſeeme fwallowed vp quite ouerwhelmed great diſtreſſe ſhort haue nother ſtrēgth ſubſtāce ſo much muſt practiſe doctrine apply right vſe following paule teacheth v namely dead life hidden paule ſhewing ſtate cōdition faithfull whyles world ſayeth life hiddē hiddē good ſtorehouſe ſayeth hiddē god sauiour ieſus chriſt life ieſus chriſt heauē glorious bodie rayſed vp made manifeſt vnto v loke wher ieſus chriſt kingdome ſhall perceiue naturall wit become neuertheleſſe ſeing life hiddē heauē ieſus chriſt may bee well aſſured wee note firſt place god minding proue faith hope ſuffer v bee cōpaſſed many danger life hang vpō threede windes carie away ſubſtance euery way ſhorte ſteade hauing one drop life hee wil ſuffer v haue thouſand death eye ſo ſhall thinke ſhould periſh thouſand wayes let v feare ſeing god kepeth v vnder ſhadow ſo long haue place retire vnto ſhal good ſafetie thus muſt wee practiſe doctrine afterward caſt eye vpō wicked behold deſtruction let v ſo muche aſſured god goodneſſe take occaſiō ſo much magnifie ſaying lorde priuilege thou haſt giuen v ſeing life thy hand thou art become keeper therof yet wherein differ ſee cō ſumed ſee come deſtructiō ſee left vnto cleane waſted lord wherin differ nothing truly ſauing thy meere mercie hath pleaſed thee chooſe v vnto thy ſelf thine inheritance thou mainteyneſt v giueſt v grace walke thy obedience thou doeſt continue ſuch benefit v thou haſt begōne guydeſt v way ſaluation frō whence lorde cōmeth wealth yet ſee priuiledge thou giueſt v though wee exempted frō miſeries frayle life asthough wee counted amongſt men lord ſeing thou doeſt honour beſtoweſt benefite vpon v muſt needes magnifie ſuch goodneſſe thine towardes v thus ſay wee haue knowen fauour god ſheweth faythfull ſeruants ought ſo much confirmed therein alſo ſtirred vp giue thankes ſame bycauſe done vnleſſe wee beholde deſtruction wicked reioyce thereat therefore alſo good v knowe god puniſheth wicked poureth ſome token vengeance vpon thē done aſſure v fatherly fauour loue hee beareth v warde nowe eliphas hath thus ſpoken exhorteth iob acquaint himſelfe god bee peace ſaying ſame ſhall turne proſperitie addeth ſhould receyue lawe god place wordes harte ſaying iob ſhould acquaint himſelfe god meaning hee earſt withdrawne himſelf ſaying hee ſhould peace ſignifieth wicked life hee declared himſelfe enimie god euill applied perſon haue already ſeene yet doctrine ſelfe true profitable howe firſt heere declared vnto v menne runne aſtry muche eſtranged themſelues god therfore giuen ouer vice wee ſpyte god let vnto doth drawe neere vnto v much ſhould take leaue el runne away without taking leaue deede without cauſe scripture ſayeth men haue feare god eye knowe god take ſuch libertie vnto themſelues vvee ſee men growe wilde become ſuch brute beaſts nomore houſhold god yet thinke good caſe ſo departed ſo long thinke vpō vice ſinnes thus much firſt secōdly ſhewed v mē make warre againſt god needeth herault trumpette make ſolemne defiance men ſhewe themſelues mortall enimies god wage warre agaynſt ſo oft runne aſtray pepart obedience ſubiects ſhould riſe vp againſt king pray warre much wicked bene ſome colour reaſon ſolemnities obſerued wont bee nowe men giue ouer thēſelues wickedneſſe put themſelues armes againſt god moſt certayne looke many wicked affection luſtes v ſo many men armes haue ready fight againſt god iuſtice much behoueth v note well thys place wit take vnto ſelues ſuch libertie euill take away al familiaritie wee haue god become wylde beaſtes ſo ſtray vnder hande obedience yet greater miſchiefe ſquare willingly wittingly raunge ſelues battell agaynſte god ſo behold horrible thyng creature ſhould lift vp himſelfe againſt hath faſhioned ſhall get ſhal haue victorie ſee well worſe madde ſeing wee ceaſſe yet run thus ragingly againſt haue note vpon place contrary part let v follow exhortation giuen v heere whiche time haue gone way luſtes haue cauſed v ſo ſtray ſcatter abrode become wilde beaſts ſo god lay hande v wee haue kept ſelfe vnder gouernement behoueth v let v ſeke acquaint ſelues ſay lette v indeuer winde ſelues familiaritie ſhall done know god calleth v vnto woorde ſeeth bee gone aſtray way ſayeth come agayne come agayne god cauſing worde preached vnto v tēdeth end make v • ame whereas wee haue bene wilde ſay taught layd hande firſt vvhen haue learned leſſon wee ſhall haue profited well whole life wherto tendeth whole holy scripture make v famililiar god true oure god part doth ſhew himſelfe ſo familiar nothing nurſe mother doth onely compare himſelfe father louing gentle childrē ſayth alſo mother nurſe seing god vſeth ſuch familiaritie v let v lyke wylde beaſtes wee haue bene let v cōtinue ſo ſtill ſee haue bene ſo froward ſo madde moue warre agaynſt ſinnes lette v ſeeke meanes bee peace ſhall lyeth v hee muſte preuent v infinite goodneſſe vvhich thing hee doth goſpell preached whiche named doctrine peace paule ſpeaketh meſſage reconciliation seeyng god calleth v owne good preuēteth v tarying til come ſeeke peace cōmeth v ſeeketh nothing elſe reconciled v let v ſo vngracious reiect vnkindneſſe make acc • pt benefit offereth vntoo v let v wyth true humilitie yeeld ourſelues ſubiect vnto knowing ready receyue v name sauiour ieſus chriſt cauſe v feele wil gentle pitifull father vnto v true childrē nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgemēt fault knowing would deale rigorouſly v wee ſhould hundreth time ſwallowed vp alſo worthy maynteyned mortal life therefore muche leſſe worthy heauenly inheritance infinite glory hee hath prepared v heauen acknowledging ſinnes vnbeleefe wherevnto wee ſo much inclyned let v pray mercie pleaſe beare v vntill attonement made betweene v wee may take ſuch profit chaſtiſements hee ſendeth world may alwayes acknowledge iudge worlde leaue iniquity vnpuniſhed long ſo euer tarie ende meanes wee child may bee moued feare honour father knowing hee prepareth v eternall inheritance heauen notwithſtanding poore miſerable ſtate worlde may pleaſe graūt grace v alſo people c lxxxvij sermon fifth vpon xxij chapter sermon ſtill vpon xxij verſe afterward vpon text hereunto annexed 23 thou returne almightie thou ſhalt buy vp dryue avvay iniquitie far thy tent 24 thou ſhalt lay golde vpon duſt pebble ſtone riuer golde ophir 25 almightie ſhall driue away thine enimies thou ſhalt haue ſtrong fortreſſe 26 thou ſhalt take pleaſure almightie lift thy handes god 27 thou ſhalt make thy prayer vnto hee ſhall heare thee thou ſhalt pay thy vovves 28 thou ſhalt determine thing ſhall eſtabliſhed vnto thee light ſhall ſhine vpō thy vvayes 29 vvicked bee throvvne dovvne lifted vp god ſhall ſaue thoſe looke lovvly 30 innocent ſhall deliuer countrie ſhall bee preſerued pureneſſe thy handes according haue already declared wee muſt take exhortation made vnto v ſhew v true repentance surely eliphas hath miſapplied perſon iob yet holy ghoſte meant deliuer v generall doctrine ſuch one might greatly profite v heere haue ſeene bee acquaynted god man hath gone aſtray men giue ouer themſelues euill quite forget god turne backe become wilde men like runne aſtray ſorte doo alienate themſelues god ſo muſt wee acquaynt ſelues ſuffering gouerne v ſhewing ſelues eaſie bee guyded ſo wee may become like lammes play wilde beaſtes hee giueth v ſigne come vntoo eliphas hath ſpoken thus hee addeth hee whiche▪ hathe gone aſtray ought take lawe mouth god place woordes hearte notable poinct rule good life ſhould heare god ſpeake vnto v knowe way whiche hee ſheweth v whiche ought holde seeing men go aſtray way ſaluation ſo ſoone ſwarue lawe god therefore ſayde expreſſely place wee muſte receyue lawe mouth howebeeit aſmuche allowing whiche ſpoken vnto v wee haue eliphas addeth wee muſt ſettle heartes although man yeelde himſelfe obedience god concerning outwarde appearance chiefe poinct wee knowe ſhall greatly aduauntage v abſtayne doyng euill onely touching eye handes feete harte muſte go guyde reſte vvill wee profite well ſchoole god worde muſt take deepe roote heartes according ſayde hee regardeth truth contrariwiſe abhorreth hypocriſie nowe wee ſee wiſe wee muſte turne god wee haue bene banniſhed ſay wee muſt become ſcholers mayſter thereby wee may gather whiche walke according pure worde god gone aſtray although men allow well them▪ wee ſee oftentimes men thinke nothing holineſſe thoſe whiche followe owne fooliſh deuotions hath beene ordinarie abuſe euen frō beginning worlde raigneth yet day muche men needes gouerned pleaſure yet thinke doings ought well allowed god contrariwiſe auouched heere ſayde whiche walke according woorde god▪ gone aſtray doubt perſwade themſelues life good holy may bee men clappe handes token like well one onely competent iudge giue ſentence cafe authoritie whiche god wee heare hee pronounceth therefore wee muſt replie iuſtifie fooliſhe deuotion ſay wee thinke ſuche thing good owne fancy muſt bee layde downe wee muſte harken god ſayeth ſuffer haue maſterſhip ouer v ſhewe v way hee haue v followe wee muſte firſt learne true doctrine oftentimes tolde v yet without cauſe holy ghoſt ſpeaketh ſo much wee ſee howe men wedded owne alwayes wiſe owne conceytes wee finde heart giue god ſuch honour ſhould haue maſterſhip ouer v wee ſhould ſubiects thus prouerbe ſayeth • commaunded v become diuels ſeruants let v examine thing termed name god ſeruice papiſtrie vvhat ſhall man finde meere inuentions menne▪ one ſyllable holy scripture warrant thing wherein papiſts trauayle ſo much acceptable vntoo god cleane contrarie yet wee ſee howe wedded wherefore reaſon ſayd diueliſh pryde men abyde bee ſubiect god receyue lawe mouthe true firſte ſay good reaſon god ſhoulde haue dominion ouer v yet wee ſee rebellion vſe vvherefore ſtriuing adayes bycauſe require nothing ſhould bee added diminiſhed pure law deliuered v frō heauē papiſts could cōtented gouerned pure doctrine god ſhould ſoone agree togither ſhould diſputation wil haue lawes ſtatutes obſerued meane ſeaſon none accompt bee made whiche god ordeyneth matter whereaboutes ſtriue although know abuſe ſuperſtition men walke owne yet notwithſtanding men bee ſtayed go ſtill beyond meaſure ſee hard thing ſtay mē bridle bowing neckes downe caces receyue yoake god lay vpon them▪ yea haue caſt tirannie pope cannot quietly yeeld ſelues obedient vnto god without gainſaying▪ thing ſeeme bee hard troubleſome wee kicke agaynſt maketh v ſo bolde bycauſe ſuche wilfull loftineſſe preſumption mindes men cannot content themſelues ſimple lawe god ſee needfull v oftentimes put remembrance point wete muſt hearkē god ſpeaketh vnto v hereby put mind wee like wretched beaſts neither wiſedom diſcretion v neuer knowe right way till god reache hand vnto v ſhew v way ſhould walke thus muche one poynt furthermore alſo declared vnto v ſhall ſtill bee caried away euil affection till wee haue learned inured ſelues obey god without gainſaying replie ſo long wee reſerue libertie ſelues cannot bee choſen wee muſte ſtriue ſwel rankle againſt doctrine god preſſe v muche witte beyond capacitie vvhat muſt let v lay v ſtriuing fayre reaſons inuent defence fancy wicked luſtes let v become meeke lambes ſuffer god handle v liſt ſo ſone ſhal giue v token come vntoo finally ſhewed v muſt like ſhaking reedes ſuffer ſelues led way way according papiſts deede confeſſe muſt follow whiche god cōmaundeth mixte therewithall owne fooliſhe toyes yea worſe thing ſo eſteeme men inuentions holy scripture deſpiſed thereby make ſuch cōfuſed mixture al thing man cānot tell ſhould preuayle god mē haue touched holy ghoſt maketh diſtinction betweene god creature ſignifiyng wee ſhall neuer well gouerned haue right reformation liues vnleſſe god aboue reigne ouer v become teacher maſter know whole perfectiō life cōſiſteth ſimple obeying thus much cōcerning ſaying muſt alſo beare wel remēbrance eliphas addeth cōcerning ſettling god lawe heart haue already touched ſeruice god make fayr ſhews men may well iuſtifie v whē ſee nothing v reproue ſo bicauſe cānot behold ſecrete affectiōs peculiar vnto god ſearch men hart although men deeme v angel yet hart bee right pure ſettled vprightneſſe ſoundneſſe whereof scripture ſpeaketh ſo much reſt ſhall vaniſh away like ſmoake ſo leade holy life wee muſte begin feete yet hāds ſay refrayne ſelf euill ſuch ſort found blame worthy euery v muſt enter himſelf know euill appetite rebellious againſt god cānot raigne ouer v vntil ſuche time ſame quite put away let v ſee purge heart end may walke ſoūdly god intēd bring forth good fruit al life lōg let v looke firſt good roote ment whē ſayd liue ſpirit walke alſo according ſpirite ſet downe life afterward workes vve muſt firſt liue ſpirit god ſay ſpirite god muſt dwell v beate downe contrarie worde god rightuouſneſſe afterward ſame muſt appeare whole conuerſatiō life men may know tree bringing forth ſuch fruit cauſe alſo ſayd worde god hath propertie ſharpe two edged ſword examine trie euen maree ſo may nother thought affection men ſame ſhould bee wholly diſcouered alſo place ſayd profite woorde god ought reproued themſelues ſay muſt appeare god preſent themſelues heauenly ſeate diſcouer offence hidde cauſe haue ſpecially declared profite well ſchoole god wee muſt take woorde heart followeth thou returne vnto almighty thou ſhalt buylt ſhalt driue away iniquitie far thy tent afterward thou ſhalt lay golde vpon duſt thou ſhalt haue ſuch ſtore gold ophir pebble ſtones riuer eliphas better ſtirre vp iob ſheweth profit ſhal come vnto ſhall ſo conuerted vnto god wee muſt alwaies leaue perſon iob bicauſe theſe thing euill applied vntoo yet doctrine ceaſeth good v meete ſaluation accordingly ſee god vſeth like ſtile whē exhorteth v repētance wit doth ſimply commaunde v ſhould addeth promiſſe intent incourage v better vnto deede ſhould heare onely dutie certified god good toward v would meane ſtay v hinder v ſo wee ſhould haue zeale affectiō draw neere vnto god vvhen • man doubte knoweth whether ſhall doo himſelfe good cōming vnto god hee becōmeth careleſſe therfore may willing returne right way wee muſt aſſured god doth wayte vpon v ready receyue v yea doth already reach hand vnto v haue aſſurance ſelues wee moue one finger breadth much leſſe cā come vnto wee ought nay rather worſe men alwayes aſſay runne backe doubt good god yea maieſtie ſhal fearful vnto conceiue mindes god deale rigorouſly v iudge vve muſt need ſo afraid runne much poſsible v thus ſhort ſee vnles haue taſted fatherly goodneſſe god aſſured hee ready receyue v mercie man ſhall neuer cauſe v ſo much • ome repentance cauſe ſpecially ſayd place iob returne god wil bliſſe euery way whereas hath bene ſpoyled ſubſtance ſhal enriched agayne euer ſhall haue plenty golde ſiluer ſhall haue thing god ſo proſper ſhall nothing cauſe ioy thankeſgiuing vve ſee briefly minde eliphas namely iob ſhold ſtirred vp returne vnto god cōceyuing ſayd good hope that▪ ſhall come vaine diſapointed ſeeking god bycauſe alwayes ready forgiue v offence whē runne vnto infinite goodneſſe blot ſinnes true eliphas doothe alwayes paſſe meaſure thinketh god maketh thoſe loueth proſper alike world great ouerſight wee ſee god afflicteth proueth pacience making ſubiect • ny miſeries yet al ceaſeth loue thē therfore mē muſt deceiue themſelues imagining god ſende heart deſire • e mercyfull vnto muſt come againe ſayde law wit like aduerſities ſcourges puniſh ſinnes ſo contrariwiſe receyueth v vnto come repentance ſhall handled ſo louingly hee cauſe v proſper ſo farre forth ſhall expedient ſaluatiō howſoeuer doctrine true profitable returne vnto god iniquitie ſhall driuen v meanes ſhall proſper cauſe thus afflicted one pouertie diſeaſes many torment layd him▪ bycauſe god father taketh pleaſure dealing roughly v ſurely therfore bicauſe wee meete enioy benefit whiche hee hath prepared v ready beſtow vpon v ſeeth wee abyde ſhould deale v according naturall inclination ſay ſhould ſend v wee would deſire wealth health eaſe would become drunken pleaſures kick againſt god horſes well fedde pampered god perceyuing vſe wel benefit beſtoweth vpon v cutteth bycauſe niggard haue ſayd bicauſe knoweth beare cōſtrayned beſtow benefit vpon v ſmall portion end may hunger thirſt bicauſe ſo inclined ſpend riotouſly alſo followeth wicked tayle ſpiritual drunkenneſſe make accompt become ſo wanton cā enjoy v cauſe afflicted ſo many wayes furthermore let v conſider offence euery one v committeth god ſhould let v alone vncorrected ſhould one man would fal aſleepe ſinnes become ſo hardened boldeneſſe would increaſe god pe • ceyuing bare much v hee ſhould ſuffer v runne deſtruction findeth remedie miſchiefe therefore wee ſo muche beholding bounde vntoo ſhort conſtraine god deale ſo rigorouſly v doth wee would giue place goodnes certain would make v proſper euery way world ſhould vnto v earthlie paradiſe ſhould nothing reſt ioy wee ſhould haue cauſe always lift vp ourheads according mentiō made heere cauſe ſayd retourne vnto god wil chaunge aduerſities miſeries welth life ſhal ſo happy wee ſhall haue cauſe reioyce fully giue thanks hath bin ſo good father vnto v haue found ſuche one brief • ſumme place haue good profitable leſſon gather whiche hūble ſelues ſo oft afflicted wee wont ſnappe againſt god chafing fretting done v ſome great wrōg mā feele ſome want thing neceſſary maynteynāce familie matter come paſſe according minde diſpleaſed murmureth heart againſt god bee ſtricken ſome diſeaſe yet oppreſſed pouertie man ſhal heare murmuring euery ſide thus fleſhe prouoketh v alwayes pricketh v forward kicke agaynſt god wherefore bycauſe wee conſider chaſtizing v purpoſe bring v knowledge ſinnes end wee ſhould ſigh ſelues aſhamed euils haue committed dayly doo committe retourne vntoo deſiring pardon ſame furthermore wee muſt apply vſe whiche hath bene touched ſay god ſeing v ſlowe nature returne vnto gone calleth v louingly vnto putteth v good comfort ſhal receiued ſeke vaine vvhat wil haue haue offended god deſerue caſt yea although ſhould aske forgiueneſſe hundred thouſande time yet might hee refuſe v thē ſith contrariwiſe cōmeth v aſſuring v requireth nothing elſe one v wil ſeke attonemēt already wholly diſpoſed thervnto muſt needes followe verie hardharted ſtifnecked wee come vnto yeeld ſelues wholly hart mind furthermore let v note wel remedy v retourne vnto god call remembrance promiſes maketh v otherwiſe ſhould always flee haue ſayd although made ſhewe though wee diſpleaſed ſinnes ſome hartebiting remorſe conſcience wicked life yet could neuer haue minde change life zeale giue ſelues vnto god vnleſſe know wil mercifull vntoo v thing profitable vs▪ neuertheleſſe ill practiſed day exā ple amongſt papiſts talking repentāce knowe diuell hathe ſo bewitched repentāce nothing elſe faſt certain dayes mumble vp certain pater noſters play hypocrite true repētance mā forſake ſelf put old skin bee wholly renued outwarde apperance inwarde affection vtterly vnknowne amongſt papiſts howbeeit let v graunt know repentance muſt retourne vntoo god yet want principall poynt doo aſſure wretched ſinners god wil merciful vnto nother know grace mercie talke much dooing penance aduentures ſeing knowe whether bee loſte time whether ſhall winne thing indeuering retourne vntoo god ſhall come euen haue ſhewed scripture declareth vntoo v ſufficiently namely men may well tourne cote ſhall neuer drawe neere vnto god good pure ſound affectiō vnleſſe perſwaded fatherly loue towards according ſayd pſalme lorde thou ſhalt neuer bee feared neyther euer obey thee til know thy goodneſſe vve ſee thē profitable preſent leſſon v better expreſſe ſame heſayth expreſſely man ſhal reioyce god afterward ſhall call vpon hee ſhall heard ſhall pay vowes ſaying ought wel weighed ſaid retourne right way ſhall reioyce god putteth difference betwene felicitie child world vnfaithfull imagin felicitie god giueth v vnto child vnfaithful haue ſuch aboundance welth bee reſt god giue health therwithall thinke ſelues happie therfore mindes aſcende higher carnal earthly men beholde thing preſent thus caught satan nettes thing come paſſe according mind cōcerning worlde ynough v wee deſire life happie think yea felicitie ſurmiſe beholde cōtrariwiſe god affirmeth happy know become mercifull vntoo v receiue welth hande giue thankes ſame acknowledging recordes goodneſſe loue toward v worldling reioyce glorie earthly good looke farther one god ſo haue al hart deſire heere contrariwiſe although faythfull thing heere poſsible bee imagined yet would ſtay thervpō vvherfore haue reſpect vnto principall witte whither god loue become father indeede good worlde haue taſt ſauour bee ſeaſoned goodnes god vndoubtedly true ſauce men terme make v feele good taſte benefites god ſendeth v v acknowledge goodnes loue take many recordes ſaluatiō vvhō vnfaythfull haue table wel furniſhed eate drink play glutton take farther care pleaſure cramming themſelues whē haue ſo ſpēt time muſt eyther returne feaſting againe elſe go ſleepe bee ſhorte worldling merrie forget god conclude one worde cannot bee merry playing brute beaſtes muſt caſt ſleepe ſo may haue regard god whē intend refreſh eaſe themſelues cōtrariwiſe although faithfull man haue meate drinke yet hath delight therein acknowledge therby god foſterfather ſaying ſeing hee hath care fraile weake body foloweth wil much rather haue care ſoule much deerer vnto world wee bee ſtrangers vouchſafe reache hand vnto v v gathered vnto kingdom faithful man haue conſideration ſuch care anguiſh minde nother eate drink happy mā ſayeth salomon hath cheerful hart poureth god poſsible man reioyce merrie god ſo wholly repoſe ſelf vpon able conclude god loueth ſurely reioycing wordlings rather brutiſh beaſtlynes true ioy deed fee ſame euident experience whē moſt part eate drinke go euen like brute beaſts hog ſty whē ſwil brought hee filleth belly ſo long meat laſteth muche doeth oxe aſſe euen ſo moſt part world adayes deuour benefit god without prayer without thanks giuing without acknowledging faithfull cōtrariwiſe thinke god knowing well meates ſhould turne condemnatiō ſure haue meere fauour god otherwiſe inioying good ſhould robbing god prayer ſupplication acknowledge come frō truth theceremony ynough many day pray giue thankes god mouth heart meane ſeaſon one whit touched therwith ſpeake thē looke rightly vnto god beholding meates acknowledge thēſelues ſaying god maketh v partaker thoſe benefit vpon cōdicion child well wee inioy part enheritance earneſt peny hee giueth v aſſure v hath created thing ſakes child muſt imputed vnto v theft yea high treaſon faithful enter ſuch tēptation thervpō muſt need ſtricken great ſadneſſe anguiſh mind ſo cannot ſwalow downe one crūme bread mirth contentation wee haue note vpon place ſayd mā truely conuerted ſhal reioyce god according alſo ſayde lawe thou ſhalt eate drink preſence thy god ſhale merry alſo god doth well ſeperate child faythful one vnfaithfull ſhewing although wicked haue meate drink abundantly yet ceaſe accurſed deynties pleaſures ſhall bee turned confuſiō let v tempted become like vnto leade happy life rightly inioy benefit god beſtoweth vpon v wee muſt haue eye homage know ſheweth ſelf foſterfather cauſeth v feele goodnes end might drawen vp higher alwayes aſſured fatherlie loue hee beareth v bee ſhort corruptible benefites whiche beſtoweth vpon v world might help lifte v vp heauen lay holde vpon eternall life whereunto oure good god hath called v farthermore meanes howe reioyce aright god alſo immediatly expreſſed namely calling vpon paying vowes vnto hee hath hearde v good profitable declaration ioye inaſmuch nothing elſe curſe god benefites receyue hande vnleſſe taſte goodneſſe ſo wee may reioyce wholly repoſe content ſelues ſtandeth v hand conſider well howe may atteyne vnto true meanes expreſſed muſt firſt call vpon afterwarde paye vowes hee hath hearde v two thing perteyning dutie thirde promiſe god maketh v ſhal call vpon vaine prayer voyde vnprofitable end therfore whereat muſt beginne pray vntoo god yea euen wee reache handes one way eate drinke begin ende thats ſay calling vpon god certaynly order peruerted let v learne cheefe exerciſe ſtudie whiche faythfull ought haue worlde runne vnto god acknowledging bee fountaine goodneſſe ſeeke proteſting looke ſo much one drop welfare eyther bodie ſoules giuen free mercie goodneſſe vvhen haue learned well leſſon wee ſhall inflamed pray vnto god otherwayes ſee howe neceſsitie vrgeth v ſuch ſorte maner wittes endes euery man confeſſe pouerties affliction wherewith wee inuironed infinite yet howe ſlacke ſlowe wee praye vnto god whereas hundred thouſande cauſes one daye vrge v pray vnto god ſcarcely doo thinke three foure tymes yet ſo coldly nothing bee therefore wee ſhall haue profited greatly wee haue learned leſſon practiſe behoueth v proteſting benefites receyue hande longeth vnto giue v ende wee ſhoulde go vnto doubting wont promiſſe added therevntoo hee immediatly heare v without promiſe al prayer nothing elſe meere hypocriſie pray vnto god witneſsing fayth vvell doubt wauer ſtand mammering know whither god heare v certaine wee haue fayth ſo wee take name god vayne foraſmuche prayer whiche ought bee teſtimonie ſaythe declareth nought elſe vncertaintie v nother muſte thinke hee heare v wee go ſuche ſorte deede one cheefe article chriſtian beleefe aſſure ſelues god promiſe hee readie receyue oure prayer time often come vnto beeing perſwaded taryeth v requireth nothing elſe ſhoulde ſeeke gate open vnto v ſo wee come vntoo name oure lorde ieſus chriſte heereby ſeene chriſten leefe hath bene aboliſhed vnder pope yet ſtill preſent ſpeake muche theyr praying vntoo god certayntie haue ſhall bee hearde none contrariwiſe aſhamed ſay wee muſte go doubtingly ſay opinion euen greate doctours onely ideotes ſay preſum tuouſneſſe pray vnto god ſtedfaſt beleefe hee heare v ſhall obteine requeſts ſurely horrible trayterouſneſſe men wauer gaze praye vntoo god heereof commeth ſuperſtitiouſneſſe wee muſte haue patrones make interceſsion v vntoo god beſides euerye man priuate patrone muſt alſo haue ſpeciall warrant haue neuer doone vvhen haue patched peeced toogither ſo knowe whiche ſide turne wherevnto hold greate clerkes ende beginning knowe whither haue gotten thing theyr praying vnto god furthermore neuer praye vntoo god ſerue laſte patrones aduocates muſte haue firſte wordes firſt frutes prayer cheefe ſeruice god requireth v thing wee conuey ouer vntoo creature god hath refuſe mennes leauings cō mon dealing popedome onely ideots haue ſayde greateſt clerkes follower diueliſh doctrine mainteyned ſo ſee chriſtian beleefe hath bin deſtroyed aboliſhed therefore ſo muche ought magnifie goodneſſe god plucking v ſo bottomleſſe pittes ſo much better ought wee ſticke doctrine declared heere beleeue ſtedfaſtlye wee ſhall ſeeke oure god vaine wee call vpon truth bycauſe foraſmuchas hee telleth v hee heare v yea hee tary vntill open mouth holdeth hand already ſtretched helpe v neede ſpeaketh prophet eſay cauſe promiſes ſo oftentymes repeated holye scripture withoute reaſon ſoeuer god promiſed men cannot bee perſwaded hee wyll heare bee ſhorte wee cannot gyue credit vnto god oure owne lye wee beleeue muche cauſe god ratifieth promiſes hath made hee heare v wee muſte note ende god ſo gracious vnto v ſo readye helpe v neceſsities ende wee ſhoulde paye vowes ſay wee ſhoulde oure thankeſgiuing proteſte thing thing wee bounde vntoo woorde vowe importeth ſolemne recorde men yeelde declaring haue thing god gifte aboue cannot require god agayne preſente thing ſaue onely prayſe thanks ſayd pſalme vvhat ſhall giue vnto lorde benefites haue receyued receyue cuppe ſaluation call vppon name vvee ſee god requireth nothing v wee ſhoulde doo homage benefites acknowledge liberalitie ſo muche extoll mercye whiche hee hath vſed towards v thus way v reioyce oure god knowing muche wee beholding vnto ſhould giue thankes benefites thereby ſtirred vp acknowledge heereafter father honour homage due vnto aſſuring oure ſelues hee neuer faile v ſeeing haue felt ſo good mercifull continue ſame ſtill onely hee make v knowe worlde wee haue put truſte vayne trulie perfitly inioye goodneſſe ſhall haue gathered v heauenly kingdome hath purchaſed vnto v lorde ieſus chriſt nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying ſo touche v holy ſpirite offence paſte may bee aboliſhed meere goodneſſe alſo beare v dayes oure lyfe vntill ſuche time hauing whollye clothed v rightuouſneſſe transformed v intoo image hee make glory ſo ſhine v wee may feele frute inheritance nowe promiſed v ſo lette v ſay almightie god heauenly father thou haſte promiſed heare oure requeſtes whiche wee make vnto thee name thy ſonne c lxxxviij sermon first vpon xxiij chapter sermon conteyneth yet ſome thing concerneth three last verſes afterward text followeth 1 iob anſvvering ſayde 2 although talke day bitterneſſe plague paſſeth groning 3 knevve finde hovveto come vnto ſeate 4 vvould pleade cace fill mouth vvith argument 5 ſhould knovve vvhat vvould anſvvere vnderſtand vvhat vvould ſay vnto mee 6 vvould debate matter vvith force vvould put ſtrength mee 7 rightuous ſhall debate vvith ſhould acquitted euer haue conferre laſt ſaying eliphas anſwere iob whiche wee haue hearde eliphas behalf maintaineth god alwayes knowe rightuous onely ſhewe fauor whole cuntry ſake iob anſwereth although extremely delt god hād bicauſe hee hath deſerued proofe therof ſayth leaue libertie pleade cace would well declare ſinnes god doth ſo puniſh theſe two contrary ſayings treated nowe touching firſte ſaying eliphas true god hath promiſed ſhew himſelfe mercifull towarde ſerue pure hart ſame ſhal extend owne perſons alſo family yea whole cuntries yet notwithſtāding followeth god bind himſelfe one certaine rule ſee trieth pacience ſeruantes thoſe indeuer obey euery point dealeth hee one rate haue declared heere before▪ deed although ſayd cuntry ſhall deliuered cleanneſſe one man band heare prophet ezechiell ſay contrariwiſe iob daniel noe towne ſhall deliuer theyr owne ſoules yet ſhould child periſh ſeemeth deede prophet hath reſpect vnto place heere ſhewe god bounde ſaue cuntrie one man ſake may happen wil • owne libertie appoint law thing vnreaſonable truth ſayd abraham could haue bene founde fiue rightuouſe men sodome god would haue ſpared whole citie ſake although filled horrible ſinnes yet god woulde haue vſed vengeance whiche written moyſes therevpon eliphas intendeth conclude alwaies oftē one righteous mā cuntrie ſake cuntry ſhal ſaued ought racked ſo far haue declared bee ſhorte let v learne tēporall promiſes cōteined holie ſcripture ſay thoſe whiche concerne ſtate lyfe preſent ſo general ſhold alwaies ſtay vpō god reſerueth fulneſſe grace faithfull lyfe come ynoughe haue ſome taſte nother ſhoulde theyr profite bee altogither filled benefites worlde felicitie woulde wiſh hath bin declared large heretofore woulde become v euerye man woulde fall aſleepe hope wee haue heauenly life woulde bee layd water yea quite aboliſhed therefore needefull god ſhoulde waken v affliction ende might thinke vpon euerlaſting heritage promiſed v lifte vp mindes therevnto end behoueth v exerciſed many aduerſities cauſe ſayde muſte reſt peremptorily vpō certaintie promiſes preſente life god diſtributeth vntoo v according knoweth expedient v hauing alwaies eye infirmitie neuertheleſſe god alſo proſper thoſe minded ſerue make ſo feele grace ſhall haue aforehand pledge ineſtimable benefites prepared heauen yet muſte ſet mind vpon pledge againe pleaſe god afflict ſuche haue walked vprightly muſt therfore ſhrinke away hart cōclude god hath ſhaken thē rather muſt conſider meanes god intendeth drawe kill fleſhly affection cut ſuperfluities thē worldward end ſhoulde better diſpozed paſſe ſettle themſelues thing preſent thus muſt alwayes cheere vp ourſelues mids affliction make gayne god cauſeth v feele fauour conſidering ynough v haue ſome promiſes fulneſſe therof muſt ſhewed ſhould welfare heereby ſee iob iuſt cauſe rebuke eliphas maner neuertheleſſe excedeth meaſure done heeretofore better perceiued word vſeth hee ſayeth although wordes bitter yet doeth plage indureth farre paſſe groning complaynt vvhereby meeneth maketh right greeuous complaint yet men looke vpon aduerſitie wey wel ſhall find farre greeuouſer complaint ſhort iob intended excuſe himſelf cō plained ſo ſore could refraine himſelfe aſſuage owne ſorrow ſheweth hath good cauſe bee ſo exceſsiue bicauſe miſerie whiche hee indureth dooth yet farre exceede complaintes might well borne withall immediately entreth old byaſſe wherin haue ſeene heretofore would fayne go lawe god ſhewe hee might atteyne haue leaue mayneteyne owne cace ſhould well ynough cō cluſion quit cleered ſayeth god woulde vſe force againste mee deale mee order lawe might haue ſuch hearing ſhoulde immediatly gayne vpper hande matter would hard vnderſtande wee called remembrance hath bene ſayde heretofore wit although god alwayes rightuous yet two ſortes one whiche hath declared v lawe rightuouſneſſe whereby hee dealeth men whereby hee iudgeth god ſummon v iudgement ſeate deale v order lawe one kinde rightuouſneſſe iuſtice man able ſay wee iuſtly condemned wee bee cōdemned lawe god doeth god require handes ought make default ſay puniſh v according deſerts thus ye ſee one kind god iuſtice wil graūted rightfull without gayneſaying true wicked ceaſſe alwayes grunting againſt neuertheleſſe grudging yet mouthes ſtopped forſomuchas owne conſciences ſo condemne needeth none man giue euidēce againſt make long triall matter haue ſearingyron burneth thē within alſo another kind rightuouſneſſe wee leſſe acquaynted whē god hādleth v according law according may right ſo foraſmuchas lord giueth v leſſon law commaundeth v whatſoeuer cōteined although ſame farre paſſe power mā able performe thing hath cōmaunded v yet notwithſtanding wee owe yet bound vnto lawe ſo perfect peereleſſe thing ſayde infinite rightfulneſſe god according haue ſeene heretofore could find vnrightuouſneſſe angel dayſunne ſhoulde bee cleere thus yee ſee perfecter rightuouſneſſe rightuouſneſſe law ſo god liſted vſe although man performed conteyned lawe yet ſhould fayle condemned ſurely lord vſeth applieth himſelfe ſo farre forth vnto v receyueth accepteth ſayde rightuouſneſſe hee cōmaundeth though throughly perfect notwithſtanding bee ſomewhat qualified ſtate man meene man hee corrupted ſin matter neede layd forth yet large ſpecially cōcerning firſt rightuouſneſſe true ſhall neuer found hath fulfilled lawe euen faythfull ſo long abyde owne kind ſo farre fulfilling cannot ſo much think one good thought vvhat man himſelfe mortall enimie god goodneſſe haue ſhifte diſcharge ſelues agaynſt god leaue v ourſelues contrariwiſe ſhall nothing elſe prouoke wrath againe whē graūteth v grace holy ſpirite loue thing good therwithall putteth ſuch woorkfulneſſe v life becommeth mirrour example of▪ holineſſe yet fayle ſo many wayes able anſwer god one point giltie thouſand point yea wee neuer good wherein ſome blemiſh inſomuch ſhould faulty al reſpects god liſted handle v rigorouſly howbeeit god ſo graciouſe v gouerne v holy ſpirite accepteth goodneſſe hath put v notwithſtanding bee vnperfecte true forſomuchas amiſſe haue ſo much requiſite neuertheleſſe god layth infirmity ſinnes charge ſhetteth eye like father inquiſitiue owne child although ſee well ynough faultes yet hee beareth them▪ euen ſame manner doeth god woorke towardes v hee vſeth ſame pitifulneſſe forgiuing al infirmity wherthrough amiſſe let v come ſayde iob knew well ynough wretched ſinner hee ſo blinded pryde beare himſelfe hand throughly rightuous god byte without cauſe meening god woulde handle ordinarie maner ſetteth foorth lawe whiche bliſſe ſuche ſerue deale gently ſo may well foole good father manner according rule could well anſwer ſo mening god vſeth owne prerogatiue rightuouſneſſe ſecrete hidden men dealeth order lawe another conſideration men cannot take holde reach vnto reaſon witte lo meening better vnderſtoode applying forme example perſone iob perſon ſome man ſet ſide looke vvpon man god hath chozen himſelfe well indeuereth walke holily good conſcience god bliſſeth appereth token god forgetteth rather gouerneth hath care bicauſe man hath deſerued ſeeke deſerte worthineſſe creature bring nothing whiche god owne afore goodneſſe mā ſame procedeth firſt holy ghoſt man bringeth aught owne vnto god goodneſſe v ſhoulde neuer worthy well liked god ſhould reiected bicauſe alwaies ſome blemiſhe therefore lorde maketh faithfull proſper hath giuen deſire walke according hee vſeth ordinarie rightuouſneſſe wit rightuouſneſſe ſetteth foorth vnto v lawe looke mee vpon iob faithfull man hath ſerued god pure right meening minde yet notwithſtanding tormented extremitie ſeemeth god hath ſette vpon ſcaffolde ſhewe dreadfull vengeance ſhorte aught man coniecture hee handled roughlier thā cain iudas meeneth ſuche ſtraunge manner dealing heerevpon iob ſaieth lord vſeth ſecret iuſtice ſay hee vſeth ordinarie rule conteyned lawe intēdeth trie iobs pacience make example whole world ſhort intendeth ſhew authoritie hath ouer creature notwithſtanding ſo ceaſſeth rightuous meene euen although deale altogither maner haue declared already god vſeth ſayde extraordinarie iuſtice towards men howbeeit iob thought ſo ye ſee god ſhall rightuous ſtill although proceed according rule law let v trie whither iob ſpake rightly ſaying ſo ſurely ouerſhot himſelf proofe thereof let v take ſentence ſet downe hee debate mee force ſayth ſhal haue reaſon howe meeneth god deale force go law would giue hearing iob preſuppoſeth god vſeth abſolute lawleſſe power terme towardes ſhould ſay god wil liſt although order iuſtice plaine lordly ouerruling heerein iob blaſphemeth god although god power infinite yet notwithſtāding imagine ſo abſolute lawleſſe much make tirāt vtterly cōtrary maieſtie lord vſe might without right nother leſſe rightfull mightfull rightfulneſſe mightfulneſſe thing inſeparable therefore iobs ſaying euill purpoſed haue ſayd afore blaſpheme god yet wandering wordes eſcape came bicauſe could bridle affection nowe let v come handeling matter truth hitherto haue layde foorth matter vvhereas ſayde two ſortes rightuouſneſſe iuſtice god true howbeeit applying according iobs imagination miſapplying nowe let v come pure truthe may knowe matter goeth behooueth v beare minde hath bin declared heretofore wit god law applieth himſelfe vnto v requireth ſo muche owe according mannes abilitie performe meene abilitie corrupted abilitie perfect ſoundneſſe ſuch adam fell ſuch angel heauen haue yet ſtill yee ſee god lawe hath reſpect vnto abilitie yea let v conſider well manner worde abilitie vnderſtood according want wretchedneſſe v nowe nowe wee nothing euill according ſtate wherin wee ſhould haue continued ſafe ſound corruption entered oure nature better vnderſtanding hereof let v take angel mirrour beholde angelles indeuer ſerue god tempted euill affection rebelliouſneſſe ſinne yet notwithſtanding although obedience yeelde vnto god pure reſpect v ceaſſeth bee imperfecte bee compared infinite maieſtie god nowe god liſted coulde vſe v extraordinarie manner ſay although law rule v yea although perfourmed conteyned lawe yet mighte hee iuſtly condemne v hee contented rule hath giuen ſhewing hee pytyeth poore creature cauſe angel pure accepted rightuouſe let v paſſe god hath promiſed bliſſe ſuch walke pureneſſe hart hand yea howbeeit condition reſerue alwayes himſelfe preheminence iudge meete expedient oure welfare god perceyue wee haue neede chaſtized hee although wee haue minde ſerue haue put indeuoure thereto yet wyll hee therefore miſſe handle v roughlye ſometimes ſo ſhal ſeeme haue offended greeuouſly wickeddeſt worlde puniſhing v ſorte iob thought ſeemed god ought haue hild himſelfe contented obedience yelded god puniſhing proceeded ſimplie abſolute power ſhoulde ſay god delt wilfully ſet purpoſe ſhew ſtrēgth arme ouerwhelming poore creature wiſte doo ſay reaſon dooings theſe wordes woorthy blamed yea accurſed howe vvhereas god hath ſo afflicted iob wee ſee true hee ment puniſh ordinarie manner deſerte yet might haue puniſhed ſo euen law ſurely god beareth v accepteth oure workes good woorth wee grace holy ſpirit although faulty bound ſo hath giuen v law intent ſubiect v bound vnto v doth owne free goodneſſe man would compell ſhoulde wrong yes therefore iob misbehaueth himſelf behalfe man ſhall haue walked vprightly poſsible yet ſhal found faulty god ſo may iuſtly ſende affliction world man muſt faine condemne humble himſelfe acknowledge hath deſerued yet thus ye ſee wherein iob beguiled himſelfe aſmuche god owne meere goodneſſe beareth child taketh theyr woorkes woorth thoughe deſerue ſeemeth iob god vſeth crueltie towardes leaſtwiſe abſolute lawleſſe prerogatiue dooth ſo true god intent puniſhe iobs ſinnes hee another reſpect went another way woorke according haue ſhewed minde trie iobs pacience wheras meane many wicked men worlde made merrie triumphed ſame tyme god made ill countenaunce towardes ſo ſee minde handle iob according deſertes howbeeit wee muſte alwayes conclude god euen according lawe coulde haue ſente iob hundred time aduerſitie ſo hee ſhoulde haue bene able beare leaſte offence wee committe treſpaſſeth agaynſte maieſtie god pray puniſhment greate ynough ſo huge offence impeaching god maieſtie caſting downe iuſtice ouerwhelmed hundred thouſande time yet comparable hideouſneſſe cryme wee haue committed iob reaſoneth awry ſaying god hādleth rule law surely hee ſayde according ordinarie manner mening god intended puniſh ſinnes ſome cauſe ſayde well truly hee ſayeth ſee well god vſeth exceſsiue power thundreth agaynſte mee though hee woulde diſpatch mee therefore muſt fayne holde peace vvhen hee ſpeaketh ſo doubtleſſe hee playeth horſe broken looce hee time pacience howbeeit pacience ſuch boyled great wallop caſte ſome froth skum thus ye ſee opening matter iob handleth heere foraſmuch theſe thing high laying foorth proceſſe matter may giue yet ſome greater light therefore let v come iob ſayeth hath declared bitterneſſe ſoeuer hee hath vttered ſtomacke yet greefe ſurmounteth complaint ſayeth lawfull mee finde god meeneth meeneth go lawe manner men doubte god ſhoulde abace himſelfe ſo farre go lawe v yet could neuer winne cace cauſe hee ſayeth prophete eſay let v ſet iudge vmper betwixte v ſee ſhall go better vvhen god ſpeaketh maner hee meeneth reſigne office ſtoupe ſo lowe ſubmitte himſelfe man tyrall body ſhoulde preſume gyue ſentence vppon meening effecte althoughe hee ſhoulde forbeare hys authoritye ſome man appoynted bee iudge betweene v yet ſhoulde wee fayle condemned vvee might well pleade ſelues might well alledge reaſons yet ſhould confounded bicauſe god woulde alwayes bee able find ſome fault v marke one poynt therfore iob ouerſhooteth himſelfe muche wiſſhing find god might go lawe ſay wiſſhing god ſhould ſtoupe ſo lowe might take aduerſarie pleade cace againſt iudge although priuiledge god ſhould graunt deſire yet ſhould alwayes put ſhame maketh beguile himſelfe bicauſe tormentes troubled ſuch wiſe hee maiſter wittes ſawe vexation darkeneſſe elſe eye blinfolded conſidered god coulde finde blame himſelfe priuy liſted examine rigorouſly heereby wee bee warned ſtand vpon gard god ſendeth v afflictiōs therfore let v take heede hold ourſelues ſhort bicauſe ſhall hand dazeled paſsions miſchefe pinche v ſo ſore wee ſhall knowe become muche euerie v neede looke narrowlye himſelfe god ſend v aduerſities let v aſſure ſelues ſhoulde vanquiſhed beaten downe hand vphild v grace furthermore let v beleeue owne liking fleſhly reaſon alledgeth thing v let v ſay ala imagineſt thou ô wretched creature beſides thou art competente iudge thine owne cace thy miſerie hath blinded thee thou turneſt aſyde ryght way thou • quiet thou mighteſt iudge much better thou canſt thine owne conceyt caryeth thee away seeing ſo thou muſt take vpon thee ſtād defence thy cace thou muſt willingly yeeld thy ſelf giltie aſſuring thy ſelfe thou ſhalt able clere thyſelfe afore god thou muſt vtterly cōfounded lo haue mark text let v proceede iob ſayeth would god diſpute force would giue mee ſtrength hereby betokeneth god preſently diſpute reaſon againſt mayne force charging god thing meanes lighte vndoubtedly wheras doctor sorbon ſay god hath abſolute lawleſſe power diueliſh blaſphemie forged hell ought enter faithfull mannes head therefore muſte ſay god hath infinite endeleſſe power whiche notwithſtanding rule rightuouſneſſe rending god peeces ſhould make almightie without al rightuous true rightuouſneſſe ſhall alwaies apparant vnto v yet ceaſſeth continue euermore ſounde vnappayred vvee muſte meaſure god rightuouſneſſe owne conceyte greate ſtreytening wee muſte alwayes bee fully reſolued god myghtfulneſſe bee ſeparated rightfulneſſe bicauſe god cannot bee diſmembred iob ſuppozeth heere god diſputeth mayne force ſaye hee ſheweth himſelfe ſo terrible reaſon bee hande bycauſe none thing thy god may diſpoſe
