thee liſte ſelfe true howbeeit god ordereth creature ſuche wyſe muſte imagine rightuouſneſſe ſeparated power ſayde afore point wherin iob ouerſeen ſaide would god diſpute mee force certaine although god diſputed agaynſte iob force might yet ſhold haue bin ſuch lawleſſe might ſholde haue born right rightfull might notwithſtāding men could cō prehend rightfulneſſe thereof heere warned talk god mightineſſe miniſtred vnto v muſte reuerence confeſsing ſame alwaies rightful ſo haue touched alreadie muſte meaſure mightineſſe vnderſtanding thing euen groūd cauſe grudgings heard againſt god men conceyue reaſon god doth thing fall gnaſh teeth chafe againſt sure diueliſh pryde preſumption whē wil haue god gouern v liking fall cōtrolling al doings cannot cōceiue good opiniō thē except ſhew v reaſon cōtrariwiſe behoueth v honour ſaid ſecret mightineſſe acknowledging ther rightfulneſſe incloſed cānot eſpye yet ſome proue god rightuous wold aboliſh mighty power nūber theſe day cānot abide mā ſhould preach god hath choſen v owne free goodneſſe diſpoſeth al thing according owne good pleaſure nothing hapneth ordinance guiding hād bicauſe cānot brook geere fall ouerth warting ſort god haue ſo choſen ſome forſaken reſidue foloweth hath created men damnation agreable righruouſneſſe againe thing done god wil ſhall man ſay ſeing ther ſo many wicked thing done nowe theſe wretched fooles rather madde men cannot finde harte ſtoupe ſo low ſay deede ſtrange caſe god hauing created mē wil alſo ſaue thēal neuerthelater let v aſſure oure ſelues god rightuouſneſſe high deepe v atteine vnto day come lorde make v able vnderſtand thing hiddē v ſayde wee know partly darkly whē become like ſhall onely ſee alſo ſhall perfectly vnderſtand thing yet diſcloſed vnto v theſe drunken ſots ſotted ouerweening cannot abide yelde god ſo much glory ſubmit thēſelues wholly vnto man ſpeake thē god prouidence anſwer come paſſe mā ſhold cōdēned euill hath cōmitted yet ſame ſhold done wil god cannot diſcerne man beeyng conuicted naughtineſſe iuſtly cōdemned ſame yet god purpoſeth another end vnknowen v lob hath well ſhewed fathering affliction vpō god whē theeues robbed good ſayd god done howbeit another reſpect theeues done albeeit theſe thing ſtrange v yet muſt fall ſlaundering god rightuouſneſſe rayling thus thing ſayd noted ſtrayne muſte put god vnder ſuche rule able cōceiue vnderſtāding rightuouſneſſe far paſſeth reache witte vvhat done vve muſt humble ourſelues ſoeuer god worketh faſhion ſtrange vnknowen v muſt therfore ceaſſe conclude alwayes rightuous way whereby god trie whither wee honour namely thing fall contrarie reaſon liking neuertheleſſe ſtill magnifie name god hādled v owne wiſh world gouerned deuized head eaſie v ſay god rightuous god good bycauſe wee ſhall haue concluded already ſelues muſt ſo ſhold become god rightuouſneſſe ſhoulde bee certaine ſubiection vnto v would ſay god woulde haue thē ſhould wiſe el greate reaſon contrariwiſe haue ſayd tryeth humilitie woorketh ſuche faſhion wee cannot find good naturall witte yet neuertheleſſe confeſſe bee rightuouſe reſt priſoners vnder bridle humilitie thus ye ſee maner yeeld god glory belōging therfore although god vſe greate rigour towards v ſo knowe whiche ſide turne v ſeeme bee preſſed ouer ſore yet let v beware wee ſay iob god debateth v mightineſſe power let v take hede father abſolute power vpon god lette v conſider alwayes incomprehēſible rightfulneſſe behooueth v honour though wee perceyue ſhew ſelfe let v alwaies make concluſion lorde thou art rightuous thy iudgemēts bottomleſſe pit cauſe expreſly ſayde pſalme lorde thou art rightuous thy iudgements deepe sea therefore man muſt ſtoupe behalfe preſume enter thē ſurely ſhall neuer wade againe plunged drowned thē although ſee ſo great darke dungeon yet muſte confeſſe god rightuouſe furthermore whereas iob ſayeth heere god would giue ſtrength debate prerogatiue power let v acknowledge god giueth v ſtrength euen greateſt rigour hee vſeth gaue v ſtrength thing god nedeth vtter extreme force confound v let blowe vpon v wee diſpatched mā little ruſh withered byandby elſe flowre bud herbe whatſoeuer elſe leſſe ſhort ſhadowe therefore god ſhewe power maynteyning v wee bee vndoone yea euen leaſte aduerſitie ſende v ſhould become v vphild v liſted chaſtize v ſomewhat roughlier hee beareth v vp ſuch wiſe whē ſmiteth vpon v one hand ſtrike v downe hath hande vnder v lift v vp againe ſuffereth v quaile therefore let v conclude god afflict v hee wyll giue v ſuch ſtrength ſhall alwaies ſtand ſtedfaſt vnouercome yea verely neere v ſay v inſomuch feele ſuch aſsiſtance hand ought ſuffize v aſſuring ſelues alwayes haue ſuch reſpect infirmity make v feele grace vtter ſuch aboundance wee ſhall bee well fenced continue holie calling vnto ende lette v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgemēt fault praying make v profit true repentance open eye may learne ſearch want v condemne ſelues therwithall reſort vnto doubting hee ready heare v whenſoeuer ſeeke remedy diſeaſes alwaies ſhewe himſelf good phiſition purging v wicked affection may pleaſe open eye ende wee may behold fauour ſheweth v adopting v oure lorde ieſus chriſtes ſake giuing v pledge ſaluation therby may take occaſion comfort reioycing yea euē mids affliction temptation world ſo may ouercome battels wherewith hee liſteth exerciſe v may pleſe graūt grace v alſo people nation c lxxxix sermon ſecond vpon xxiij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon vij verſe vpon text added 8 come afore hee appeareth mee come behinde ſhall atteyne 9 come left ſide vvhere doth vvorke ſhall perceiue turne mee right hand vvill hide himſelfe ſhall ſee 10 according knovveth vvay ſo doth trie mee ſhall go golde 11 foote hath hild path haue kept vvay turned aſide 12 haue forſaken commaundement lippes haue layde vp haue ſette ſtore vvordes mouth liuing cuſtome iob purſewing matter treated yeſterday proteſteth heere god woulde handle deſerts ſhoulde bee ſo ſore afflicted hee alwayes meening god woulde proceede according rule law hereby betokeneth puniſhed offēder god hath ſome reſpect vnknowen vnto certeſſe true god dealeth ordinarie manner towards whē vttereth ſuch rigor againſt iob none thoſe haue tranſgreſſed god law ſuch wiſe puniſhment ought exā ple vnto others iob none nūber indeuered lead holy life ſo behaued himſelf towards mē alſo towards god might haue bin counted half angell cōpariſon mē therfore hath good reaſon ſay puniſhment indured ſinnes ſo acknowledged god might iuſtly hee thought good lorde beare men bee ſayde therfore bound may bee free chaſtize roughly liſt iob therfore doth amiſſe poynte acknowledgeth god meere grace hee puniſhed ſinnes agayne hee doth euill entring god ſecrete iudgements ſurmizing god vſeth abſolute lawleſſe power acknowledging ſecrete rightuouſneſſe although creature perceiue cauſe ſayeth rightcouſe might go lawe god woulde voutſafe deale order lawe yet certaine ſhoulde go way woorke muſt v needes bee condemned mortall man boaſt hath fulfilled law god written curſed perfourmeth thing conteyned lawe thus ye ſee mankinde ſhut vp vnder curſe god liſted extend rigour law towards v according sainct paule treateth ſpecially therof thirde chapter galathians iob farre ouerſeene ſaying ryghtuouſe man maye pleade hys cace god giue audience according rule law haue ſaid muſt needes yeeld ourſelues giltie onely offending ſome one poynte tranſgreſsing poynts inſomuch neuer ſerue god wee ought ſuche perfection hee deſerueth dutie requireth vvherefore followeth men tranſgreſſers lawe ſome one parte euery poynte moreouer true rightuouſe maye ſhewe themſelues god howbeit come account wherein conſiſteth oure bliſſedneſſe hauing ſinnes pardoned buried god hand written two thirtith pſalme draweth open mouth pleade againſt heauenly iudge ſtandeth v hande haue ieſus chriſte aduocate pleading cace alleadgeth deſerts ne ſetteth himſelfe defence ſay god dooth v wrong puniſhing v alledgeth amendes himſelfe hath made forſomuche hee hath releaſed v dettes quit god thus wee ſee iob offended ſaying rightuouſe iuſte dealing man may pleade cace god concerning poynt ſayd ſeeke god ſhall perceiue hee come behind ſhall ouertake hee go left hande bee hidden hee turne right hande hee ſhall ſee thereby hee meeneth god iudgements incomprehenſible true ſaying expound foure partes worlde commeth one poynt according ſayd pſalme ſhall giue mee wing flie away go ouer sea hande god long ouertake mee go downe deepes find mee flye aboue cloudes yet hand ouerreach mee plucke mee backe thence therefore one text wee vnderſtande bee ſpoken eaſt vveſt south north iob meeneth purpoſe men make long diſcourſes haue trotted vp downe world ouer yet ſhall neuer attayne great ſecretes god ſurmount capacitie reache ſenſe continueth alwaies ſame haue ſpoken namelye iob meeneth heere manner dealing whiche god vſeth towardes ſo high profounde man reaſon neuer reache vnto true ſaying ſo bee well applyed iobs fault foraſmuch hee perceiueth reaſon god dooings hee imagineth vſe abſolute lawleſſe power terme ſay god woorketh owne pleaſure withoute keeping anie order rule hee doth liſteth like prince bee ruled reaſon followeth owne liking ſo ſaying iob blaſphemeth god howbeeit bycauſe ſuddaine pang paſsions wherethrough woordes eſcaped h •• without aduiſedneſſe neuertheleſſe hee fayleth conclude alwaies god rightuous blameleſſe ſticketh euer vnto himſelfe yet notwithſtanding hee able brydle tung caſting foorth woordes ſquare reaſon paſsions wee haue marke effecte nowe may applie doctrine vſe let v vnderſtande wee muſte preache god pleade cace muſte needes bee condemned without long procesmaking behalfe mo defence excuſes thinke haue ſo much muſte ſinfulneſſe needes increace none remedie acknowledge ourſelues giltie craue forgiueneſſe mercie thus cō ming vnto god muſte pretende iuſtifying ſelues make ſatisfactiō acknowledge ſinnes beſeeche admit v owne meere goodneſſe mercie open mouth pleade cace manner debating belongeth v office giuen oure lorde ieſus chriſt therefore let v parte holde peace ſuffer ieſus chriſt bee ſpokeſman make interceſsion v meanes fault may buryed quit ſted condemned thus much haue wee beare away firſte place meane deliuer v iudge euer according paule ſayeth ſhall lay thing charge god child ſeeyng hee iuſtifyeth vvho ſhall ſtande againſt ſeieng ieſus chriſte hath taken theyr cace hande pleade ſay refuge without vndone muſte thinke come vnto god without ſhoulde ouerwhelmed wrath worthy touching ſecond point behoueth v marke god iudgementes oftentimes hidden v yet muſte therfore thinke ſtraunge ſo ſhould check againſt ſay reaſon lette v rather acknowledge god rightuouſneſſe highe thing ſuche rudeneſſe v greate preſumptuouſneſſe v deſire atteyne therevnto ſay muſte wee fully reſolued ſayde god iudgementes ſecrete wee haue ſought ſerched ranſacked vttermoſt wee ſhall bee confounded doth followe therefore god hath rule himſelf let v make compariſon betwixte v difference wayes ſayeth heauen earth truely vſeth manner ſpeach ſhew muſt eſteeme mercy according owne nature neuertheleſſe god doth generally ſhew againſt reaſon ſhould meaſure ſpan prouerb ſayth vvhat remayneth vve muſte honour god ſecretes hidden v therwithall confeſſe doings diſpoſed infinite wiſedome vprightneſſe goodneſſe man attempt doubt muſte needes come ſhame according ſaid pſalm lord howſoeuer world goeth thou ſhalt found rightuous dauid ſaw wel diueliſh pryde men needes bee alwayes replying againſt god controlling winne nothing god muſte maynteyne owne right bee ouerwhelmed theyr malapertneſſe thus ye ſee poynt well woorthy borne minde ſayde wee go ſunne riſing ſunne going downe drawe north south wee haue hunted ouer worlde yet ſhall attayne vnto god heereby wee informed god determination ſuche bottomleſſe sea wee neuer atteyne rightfulneſſe whiche infinite thing lette v conſider owne abilitie marke infirmitie v man ſhoulde beſtowe whole life traueling yet could know whole world ſhoulde know god atteyned centre ſay bottome earth little nothing ſurely coulde ſtye vp aboue cloudes yet ſhoulde wee come farre ſhorte knowing god lette v learne two thing breefly one god woorketh manner wee muſte thinke ſelues creature able men haue bin wont doo ſo ordinarie manner woorking thus thus order nature god mighty power muſte ſhut vp within order nature within ſuch bound vvhat let v confeſſe iudgements ſo depe sea cannot found therewithal let v hold ſure principle god continueth euermore rightuous notwithſtanding hee ſeeme deale crookedly ouerthwartly although finde fault wyth doings haue apparant ſurmiſes colour ſo yet ſay let v alwayes conclude thus ſelues lorde thou art rightuous according alſo ieremy ſayth true greeued ſee wicked haue full ſcope godly men bee vtterly troden vnder foote ſo thing order might ouercame right conſcience vpright dealing among men ieremie lamented ſorie againe hee ſawe wicked liue vnpuniſhed though god bin aſleepe thought vpon charge thus ye ſee hard comberſome temptation prophete indured foraſmuch knew fleſhly wit cannot conceiue god wonderfull iudgements hee maketh preface hee enter complaint moane ſaying lorde thou art rightuons thy iudgements rightfull ſpeaking manner ſhewe intendeth enter intoo diſputation god pleade fellowe matche call queſtion whether god woorketh reaſon ieremie abridged himſelfe libertie cut occaſion might haue conceyued minde therfore enter matter maketh concluſion lord howſoeuer world go although men may ſurmize thou doſt thing without reaſon yet art thou rightuous vnblamable poyntes reſpects euen ſo muſt wee ſay iob impoſsible v knowe reaſon god woorkes verie true howbeit faintly ſpoken cannot mount ſo high neuertheleſſe god woorke maner cannot comprehende muſt therfore ceaſſe acknowledge bee rightuous honour humble ſelues effect thing haue remēber furthermore let v take warning may wel make large diſcourſes ſhall gaine nothing thereby true men may haue great quickneſſe wit yet muſt ſame giue v occaſion ouerweening ſee many bicauſe haue wit wel ſharpned thinke themſelues able finde reaſon thing cauſeth run ſo aſtray end bee doted owne vnderſtanding ſay god puniſheth pryde taking toomuch vpon therefore let v conſider well wee haue trudged vp downe ſhall neuer whit nerer finding end thing lorde ſhew v wit weake rude attaine ſuch heighth knowing therefore muſt bee part muſt ſuffiſe v taſt ſome certaine meaſure thing welfare wayting latter day wee ſhall haue fully diſcouered vnto v thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne iob addeth immediatly according hee knoweth way ſo trie ſhall go gold hereby iob betokeneth god hath great aduauntage ouer cannot know ſayth iob knoweth vnderſtande workes iudgeth mine bee ſhort trieth golde furnace inſomuch ſo little peece froth infirmitie mee ſeeth diſcerneth therefore purpoſe go law concluſion maketh ſaying verie true god knoweth wayes trieth proueth v gold furnace yet notwithſtanding haue wee cauſe cōplaine match creature checke ſuch ſort take part agaynſt maker though god make v haile fellow himſelfe ought wee ſay doth v wrong iniurie therefore whenſoeuer commeth minde god knoweth wayes hee tryeth v purgeth ſifteth ſinfull affection ſuperfluous thoughtes v let v vnderſtand ſame muſt teach v lowlineſſe feare prouoke v make complaint iob dooth text herewithall ſee god intendeth bridle v al meanes owne welfare trieth v ſort commeth profite vnto knoweth bee expedient v according alſo hee commeth neere vnto v afrayde hee ſeeketh profite v nothing ſo knoweth wee haue neede bee kept obedience awe cheefe thing requireth v ſea vertue bringeth v ſaluation therfore behoueth v rightly ſubiect vnto god hild maieſtie ouer v ſhewed v wee bee ſtate hilde v vnder feete would become v conſidering pride malapertneſſe v god ſhewing v reaſon work doth end ſhould lerne obey againe ſee doth ſhall comprehend ſure ſayd trie v welfare good ſooth v trieth himſelf nay contrarywiſe ſteede lighting candle ſerch owne want ſinnes quench creſſet god hath lighted hande vvhat elſe diſcretion hee hath giuen v diſcerne betwene good euill candle hath lighted end might perceyue naughtineſſe ſelues ſee men labor quench ſayd knowledge would faine ſuppreſſe owne conſciences might liue like ſwine bee aſhamed abaſhed euill commit men go become brute beaſtes ſo ſee indeuer quench lamp candle god lighted draw triall seeing ſo good reaſon god ſhoulde ſearch trie v bycauſe wee ſelues dutie good willes woulde become like brute beaſts diſpatch ſelues al diſcretion reaſon thus ye ſee thing haue marke text forſomuch god knoweth wayes woorkes aforehand behoueth v conclude hee make v paſſe gold furnace ſame profite welfare although perceyue reaſon ought contented lorde rightuous hee ende ſhew v wherſore hath tryed v maner making v paſſe ſo many affliction gold paſſeth fire although greeuous beare yet god doth without cauſe vve perceyue yet bycauſe wit weake howbeit lord time make v perceyue wrought aduenture knew meete welfare effect thing whiche haue beare away heere nowe iob hath ſayde ſo addeth proteſtation foote bad walked god path hee bad left way turned aſyde commaundement god owne mouth bad ſet ſtore owne liuing manner dealing true iob might well proteſt hee walked ſo vprightly number diſpiſers god number looce liuers giuen naughtineſſe iob might well ſay ſo true according alſo wee ſee dauid might well ſay lorde haue kept thy commaundementes whole hart lorde haue ſet ſtore thy lawe gold ſiluer delight hath bin haue weltred wicked affection pleaſure hath bin hearing thy lawe vvhen dauid ſpeaketh maner boaſt himſelfe god another place ſayth lorde able ſtand thee thou enter account men creature bee iuſtified therefore enter iudgement thy ſeruant lorde lord ſhall ſtand vp thou marke faultes vve ſee dauid dooth willingly yeeld himſelfe guiltie whereas proteſteth himſelfe haue followed god commaundements al one acknowledged gracious giftes heé receyued hand homage ſaying thus lord thou haſt done exceeding great good thou haſte gouerned thy holy ſpirite following thy commaundements came ſelfe thy guiding cauſed giue ſelfe therevnto dauid yeelding ſuch honour vntoo god confirmed himſelfe good hope aſſuring himſelfe hee felt god good gracious heeretofore ſo hee would neuer ſayle heereafter iob proceeded maner proteſtation bin good holy meening heere go lawe god vphold god handled ordinarie rule lawe hee ſhoulde haue cauſe vſe ſuch rigour towardes iob groſſely ouerſeene behalfe god iiſted haue puniſhed ſinnes hee committed might iuſtly haue done doth meere free goodneſſe iob therefore dooth diſcerne aright betweene god perſon ſhould haue ſayd lord true thou chaſtizeſt know thou migh teſt euen thy law▪ true alſo haue indeuered walke thee great ſoundneſſe poſsible mee neuertheleſſe hath alwayes bin ſomewhat amiſſe therefore thou ſhalt find workes ſinſull iob might haue ſpoken ſo ſayd well lorde knowe well thou beareſt proceedeth thy fatherly goodneſſe although thou chaſtize yet thou makeſt mee perceyue thou doeſt ſinnes bycauſe pleaſeth thee exerciſe pacience neuerthelater meane whyle feele ſelfe combered extreemely therefore muſte conclude thou doeſt vpon ſome ſecrete wonderfull purpoſe iob ſpoken ſo bin well caried away pang hys paſsions thereby warned ſay de afore miſtruſt ſelues afflicted ye would ſay ſo dazeled wee cannot diſcerne good thing befell vnto iob ſetheere eye myrrour pacience become v therefore wee bee afflicted lette v pray god ſo hold v awe may glorifie toyes come heades grudge agaynſt may beaten downe knowing cannot ſpeake one word ſelues ſame ſhall prouoke god wrath thus ye ſee haue beare remembrance furthermore going ſentence let v learne knowe true ſeruing god iob ſheweth v howe vvhereat muſt begin wee intende giue dedicate ſelues wholly obeying god keeping way whiche hee ſheweth v men muſt frame themſelues newe deuotions owne pleaſure manner worlde whiche much giuen therevnto vvhen men bee moſt deuout would faine worke wonder make enterance following ſeemeth good owne liking yea would ſay god ſoueraintie ouer v though cheefe poynt ſeruice obedience man ſerue god aright let ſhut owne imagination doores behaue himſelfe owne liking wit let ſubmit himſelfe god worde followe ſet downe heere namely haue ſet foote walked god path haue turned aſide haue wiſe ſtepped wayes rule bin well hilde kept wee ſhoulde haue ſo great controuerſies nowe adayes papiſts aboute ſeruing god aright called god ſeruice papacie inuentions theyr owne braynes whereof god neuer ſpake one woorde vvhat call deuotion euery man owne liking aſſoone man hath mind thing beares himſelfe hand god aſmuch delighted himſelf man hee vndertaketh ſome thing behold ouerboldneſſe hath alwayes reigned world men need maiſters make lawes pleaſure god muſt bee ſaine accept whatſoeuer haue forged maner contrary wiſe holy ghoſt telleth v muſt lift vp one foote go foreward onely way god ſheweth v behoueth v refrayne ſelues cace needes raunge abrode make friskes outleapes ſtray may well breake leggs necke hee ſhall neuer himſelſe good ſay wee ſhall neuer go forewarde rather euer backwarde wee bee ſo deſirous gad owne fancie let v learne faſhion liue well rightly god alloweth ſet feete way whiche wee ſelues haue made whiche hee hath ſhewed v woorde without cauſe dooth iob adde hee retyred turned backe heereby ſheweth men tempted continually tickling luſt ſtart right way according verie deede ſee god cannot holde v vnder obeyſance force euen moſt deſirous walke ſuch ſingleneſſe would neither put take away frō god word ſhall notwithſtanding miſſe feele pricking himſelfe tickeled ſteppe way ſpecially wee ſee man take ſuch libertie ſo wee ſay beholde ſuch man doth ſuch thing wee bee moued ſight ſuch example maketh v deſyrous turne way bee ſhort wee bee eaſily caried away obeying god maner meanes bycauſe wittes curious fantaſticall alſo bycauſe wee ſee thing euerye drawe v vnto euill therefore let v take heede may able proteſt truely iob wee haue ſwarued waye god hath ſhewed v wee may ſo behoueth v herken well thing god telleth v lawe men woulde ſtill beare themſelues hand god alloweth doings ſtill good way declaration iob addeth bee gaue himſelfe wholly heare commaundement god owne lippes vvherefore ſpeaketh hee commaundement god lippes ſhoulde ſeeme needeth ſhew man life ſhall alwayes vnruly diſordered bee framed law god thoughtes deedes ſo directed hee preſume ſwarue whit neuer ſo little ſerueth ſhew v vſe god woorde profite wee reape thereof vſe god worde hold v right way bycauſe ſhould looke newe inſpirations heauen satan tranſformed hee might put many illuſions heades god hath cut occaſion guilefulneſſe giuing v holy scripture therevnto haue v holde ſelues therefore let v beware wee vſe benefite god offereth v nowe therewithall matched profitableneſſe thing bee deſired man ſure ſhall miſſe walke doubtfulneſſe poore papiſts led owne imagination ſay bee doubt whether god accept doings thing throughly aſſured way hee ſheweth v infallible ſo may well walke go forwarde neerer wee come poynt ſaluation ſuch certaintie ineſtimable treaſure let v bereeue oure ſelues grace god offereth v ſee world ſo malicious froward much leuer giue ſelfe owne fantaſticall deuiſes followe vnfallible truth cannot lie vntoo v lo wee haue marke text iob ſpeaketh commaundement god lip ſhewe v god ordeyning word preached mouthes men intended haue v reſt therevpon ende wee ſhoulde ſeeke vaine gazings heere addeth hee ſetmore ſtore god worde owne liuing maner dealing hebrue worde vſeth heere ſignifieth properly ordinance decree truely three verſes hee ſaye god hath decreed eye hee vſeth ſame woorde ſet downe heere yee ſee proper ſignification worde decree determination ordinance common maner agayne ſometymes ſimilitude taken man ordinarie liuing prouiſion bycauſe parcell lawe man ſhould lay liuing muſt eate ſo much bruſt himſelfe one day hee muſt take portion nouriſhment ſuſtenance content himſelfe thus yee ſee worde alſo taken euery man ordinarie liuing prouiſion either wayes may ſtand well vvhat iob ment heere hee ment god worde treaſure eſtimation vntoo goodes worlde vvhat thing dearer vnto men nouriſhment loue liues ſo doo alſo indeuer prouide neceſſaries ſame want bread thing v diſmayd foraſmuch men haue great care mainteyne liuing iob preferring god worde ſuſtenaunce meate drinke ſheweth thereby hee made ſo great account preſent life earneſtneſſe obeying god hee muche leuer taught word thā fed beſt meate worlde heerof wee may gather good admonition ſee howe men deſirous liue onely deſirous alſo mad ſo nother meaſure ſtaye yet meane whyle wote end liue deſire life haue regard god much therefore doth ſtande v hand marke ſayde wit deſiring liue world muſt alwayes ſerue god dedicate ſelues glorie bee conſirmed hope heauenly life wherevnto calleth v poynt wherevnto wee muſt applie wit indeuers ſo follow immediately ſhall preferre god doctrine ſpirituall foode ſoules foodes wee wiſh body fed bread water yea wine dilicateſt meates deinties deuiſed vvhat purpoſe ſoules ſtarued meane oxē aſſes horſes ſhold better excellēt ſtate thē let v lerne preferre god word wherwith oure ſoules nouriſhed thing concerne tēporall flightfull life let preferring bee onely ſay learned alſo giue ſelues wholly ſeruing god obſpeaketh let v come haue declared concerning worde taken ſignifie common maner wee take ſenſe truly meening wil chāged al effect howbeit wil one point profitable worthie borne away meanes iob declareth wiſe maner wiſe men world alwayes needes followe fleſhly reaſon quite giuē ouer al ſelf liking end might ſubmit himſelf vnto god verie needfull thing according haue touched alreadie wee bee vagabundes ſtragglers wee holde way god hath ſhewed v howe may done let v cut ſay let v cut owne cuſtomes ordinance maners lyuing let euerie whit fall ground done quite cleane away ſo long men delight inuentions ſo long bee wedded owne cuſtomes ſo long ſticke wilfully owne trade lyuing impoſsible giue themſelues god one man woulde put french hoode vpon heade calfe cowe theyr nature kynde therefore cannot away yet wood commeth point wee ſhould obey god brute beaſtes thing aforeſayd vvherefore may faſhioned obey god law wee muſt learne firſt formoſt rid ſelues gay inuentions come head think ſelues ſhould good vvee haue bin wont euerie man doth ſo hath continued thus tymes vvee muſte alledge theſe thing god ſpeake word behoueth v yeeld vnto ſo wee ſee without cauſe iob hath ſayde ſought god worde doctrine conteyned ſame eſteemed thing touching word lay vp cannot diſcourſed day therefore wil let alone till morrow meane let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement oure fault praying make v ſo feele wee may learne humble ſelues onely acknowledging mightie power hath aboue v alſo glorifie rightuouſneſſe knowe ſelues alwayes wretched ſinners ſpecially knowe fault v wee may continually mourne aſſuring oure ſelues god knoweth many mo v thā ſelues perceiue foraſmuch bee full vanitie inclyned deceyte leaſings let v deſire refourme v ſuch wiſe whole ſeeking may profite ſchole may harken diligently ſound doctrine ſpoken v name bodily eares ſuch ſort may take good roote hart may deſire nothing elſe filled haue ordinarie foode may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c xc sermon thirde vpon xxiij chaper sermon yet ſtill vpon twelfth verſe vpon text enſueth 13 hee ſtill one poynt vvho turne looke vvhat heart deſyreth hee doth 14 vvill performe vvhatſoeuer hath decreed many ſuch thing 15 cauſe afrayd vvhen thinke ſtand feare 16 god hath ſoftned hart almightie hath troubled 17 cut darkeneſſe hath hidden darkneſſe face vve ſawe yeſterday obey god rightly wee muſte giue ouer owne cuſtomes maner dealing alledge one thing make go good ſeeing lord hath ſpoken muſt hold v ſimply word hath giuen v nowe remayneth marke worde ſet downe place namely wee muſt lay vp god doctrine treaſure harte vnleſſe laide vp maner neuer take liuely root according ſhall ſee many bee moued heare god ſpoken ſomwhat well diſpoſed howbeit diſpoſition throughly planted therefore ſee fayth appeared time vaniſheth away let v marke well wee haue neuer profited well god ſchoole till worde ſo deepely rooted hart ſay till wee haue receyued ſuch mind flightfull motion allowe like well thing told v hartie affection ſettled vppon good earneſt cauſe oftentymes tolde v ſeruice god inward ſpirituall although wee ſatiſfied whole worlde men thought v vtterly faultleſſe yet might god iuſtly refuſe goodly outward ſhewe wherein men ſooth v hart go afore let v beare ſaying minde behoueth v lay vp god worde howe burie beleeue hart vnto rightuouſneſſe wee muſt alſo confeſſe mouth wee may ſafe muſt god worde ſhewe ſelfe wee ſo men may thinke v yet good woorkes faythfull muſt firſt proceede ſayde hartie affection flightfull inconſtant motion furthermore worde lay vp well ynough vnderſtood wee take ſimilitude treaſure applie alſo lorde ieſus chriſt dooth ſayeth man bee well ſtored thinges hee may fetche foorth whatſoeuer hee hath neede owne houſeholde alſo men vſe man bee ſo niggardly hath cheſtes full money garner cellers throughly ſtored ſtarue himſelfe releeue bodie menne ſay ſuch one knoweth purpoſe ſerueth riche ſtarke beaſt therefore let v vnderſtande hoording muſt end may vſe diſcretely according cace ſhall require wee haue treaſure doctrine ſaluation layd vp hart muſt onely profite ſelues alſo edifie neighbour yea let v beare minde saint paule ſayth myſterie fayth muſt bee kept good conſcience thus ye ſee effect haue note vpon ſayd text wee learned god worde wee muſt conceyue ſome opinion brayne muſt lay vp diligently harte ineſtimable treaſure let v come iob addeth ſayth god minded thing man ſhal turn ſtill continuing matter hande namely god vſed abſolute power agaynſt ſo going law obteyne right haue tolde ouermuch although iob knewe god puniſhed ſinnes yet ought hee haue bin fully reſolued god rightuous vnpartiall dooings ſurmiſeth lawleſſe power hath nother rule meaſure wherein hee doth god wrong neuertheleſſe ſentence true bee applied ought namely god alwayes one poynt one mind ſay conſtant vnuariable cannot turned one way according ſee euē balaam lier inforced acknowledge god like men chaunge mind variable inconſtant hath hee ſayd thing ſaith balaam performeth doctrine ſelfe good holy scripture full matter nowe muſt applie inſtruction ſerueth two purpoſes one god hath ſpoken thing promiſeth mercifull fauourable v ſuccour v needes muſt ſtedfaſtly beleeue reſt vpon without douting whither performe promiſe vvhy truth infallible likewiſe contrary part hee threaten v wee muſt tremble aſſuring ſelues v dallie ſuch maſter thus yee ſee end thing tend ſpoken holy scripture concerning god conſtancie ſtedfaſtneſſe executing determination vve knowe god vttereth minde vnto v auoucheth himſelfe pitifull receyueth v mercie seeing lorde doth ſo call v vnto beguile v foade v ſome vayne hope therefore inaſmuch haue ſuch aſſurance good let v boldely ſtay reſt therevppon hee chaungeth though world ſhould make ſute yet ſhould cauſe alter mind meanes may glorie againſt diuell deuiſe practiſe yea although ſee whole worlde bent againſt god promiſes yet ſhall neuertheleſſe alwayes reſt according alſo wee ſee howe holy ghoſt armeth faythfull ſuch truſt teacheth defie theyr enimies goto ſayth lay heades togither worſt yet ſhall thing god hath promiſed hold end againe ſayth neere hande v diuell men haue practized vttermoſt agaynſt v hee beate downe defence ſeeing ſo may deſpyſe enimies practiſe deuiſe ende cannot withſtande god let perfourine thing hee hath ſpoken thus ye ſee wiſe ought put doctrine vre concerning ſtedfaſtneſſe god alſo let v beare minde hath bin ſayd concerning threatnings ſo rebuke vice bee ſo good v warne v let v ſtand vnamendable miſdoings let euerie v humble himſelfe looke well aboute carefulneſſe indeuer preuente curſe god hath tolde v ende doth make v feele wrath ſay ende hee woulde bee conſtreyned execute wrath agaynſt v lo true vſe doctrine god always one mind man turne ſame cauſe alſo ſayde god hath ſpoken prophete heard theſe two thing namely power iudgement god ſhould ſay lorde thou needeſt repeate thy wordes thou haſt ſpoken woorde ought ſuffiſe v much wee hundred thouſande witneſſes thou haddeſt neuer ceaſſed repeating rehearſing thing wee heard afore neede haue eares beaten ſo much vvhy ſo god truth ſo certaine one ſillable al one hee great volume yet notwithſtanding wee ſee howe lorde calleth v ratifying hys promiſes contented haue ſpoken away putteth v often remembrance thing wee haue heard haue v taughte goodneſſe life long seeing hee vſeth ſuch ouerabundantneſſe behoueth v acknowledge hys infinite goodneſſe applying himſelfe maner rudeneſſe yet muſt wee take ſuch boldeneſſe call queſtion thing hee hath ſpoken diſpute whether thing bee true god hath witneſſed vnto v wee muſt rather marke howe ſayd vnto v pſalme god ſayings ſiluer ſeuen tymes fined fornace wherein neyther droſſe ſuperfluitie like wordes mortall men dubble eyther colour wordes haue ſpoken vnſay againe finde ſome ſuttle ſhifte turne another way ſuch thing god vvhy ſo wordes ſiluer throughly fined wherein ſuperfluitie ſay ſeale faythfull ought ſet vnto thing heare god mouth ſoone god hath ſpoken thing let v according whiche hath bin touched alreadie ſet ſeale vnto nothing truth certeintie nothing vntruth man minde yet god doth v honour make v witneſſes according ſaint iohn ſpeaketh whoſoeuer beleeueth ieſus chriſt hath ſette ſeale god ſoothfaſt ſeeing god doth v honour make v witneſſes althoughe bee nothing vanitie v ſo much ought bee inflamed receyue obediently thing whiche wee heare warrant ſelues bee true followeth immediately doth ſoeuer hart deſireth heere one ſentence whiche verie true bee rightly vnderſtoode true wee haue ſeene iob niſſe imagining god vſed lawleſſe power could imagin otherwiſe god minded vtter ſtrength ſuch violence ſhould bee quite voyde reaſon surely haue erſt declared iob purpoſed ſuche blaſphemie himſelfe heere cace concerneth former pang ouerheadie nowe let v conſyder profite redoundeth v doctrine god doth whatſoeuer hee liketh behoueth v firſte formoſt knowe thing god deſyreth lyketh vve knowe cannot away vnrightuouſneſſe therefore deſire lyking muſt needes bee rightuous full equitie seeing ſo let v learne gloriſie reſpects firſt ſee thing order worlde ſeemeth go otherwiſe ought let v marke howe ſayd vnto v god holdeth reynes brydle nothing done whiche hee hath foredetermined purpoſe oftentymes wee maye thinke thing bee verie ſtraunge whiche done eye weake ſighted comprehende infinite power god vvhat done let v conclude ſo muche god rightuous becommeth v allowe dooings although fall oure lyking although ſeeme v god ought woorke otherwyſe yet let v ſubdue owne reaſon holde ſuche bondage wee maye alwayes confeſſe god anye thing whiche wroughte wyth iuſtice vprightneſſe alſo let v heere marke particularly ſeeing god hath called v hee doth alſo diſpoſe oure welfare faluation ſpeake nowe men generall comfort faythfull may gather god hath ſhewed himſelfe calleth purpoſely child vttereth heart vnto haue ſayd afore faythfull muſt hang doubt imagine theyr ſaluation mammering vvhy ſo layde vp gage hande god plucke awaye therefore let faythfull hardily bragge ſaluation god almightie according ſayde tenth ſaint iohn father hath giuen vnto ſtronger purpoſe doth chriſt ſpeake ſo ſhew ſaluation dependeth vpon ſelues vpon creature let looce hazardes god keepeth boſome forſomuch man ouercome wee bee ſure wee ſhall neuer periſhe bycauſe god hath ordering thing loueth welfare ſuche wyſe hee ſurely procure thereof wee haue good warrant goſpell wee haue ſure pledge lorde ieſus chriſt giuen v ende ſhoulde partaker lyfe goodes doctrine bee put vre ought bee ſee true holy alſo exceeding profitable v hee addeth god bring paſſe whatſoeuer bee bathe determined mee many like thing iob vſeth worde expounded yeſterday ſaid worde ſignifieth two thing wit lawes ſtatutes ordinance decree determinatiens deſtinies faſhions maners dealing order trade custome guize woont ordinarie alſo mannes prouiſion liuing ſustenance foode nouriſhment iob faith god go wyth ordinaunce determination hys ſaying hee go mine ordinarie elſe go determination nowe although ſignification wordes bee double yet notwithſtanding circumſtaunce place ſheweth v ſenſe namely iob meeneth god bring paſſe thing hee hath purpoſed vvhereby doth v vnderſtande wee bee gouerned fortune haphazard god hath determined ſhal befal v vvhen put v worlde let v looce rouers let v walke aduenture hee determyned ſhoulde become lyfe death therfore let v vnderſtand walke ſuch wiſe vnder guyding oure god lorde ieſus chriſt ſayeth cannot one heare fall oure heade good prouidence extend euen sparrowes woormes earth doth vnto v hee eſteemeth muche whome hee hath created ſhaped owne image likeneſſe therefore article wee ought marke well euerie v hath deſtinie ſay ſuche tyme god ſendeth v intoo worlde hath alreadie ordeyned haue done v guideth v ſuch wiſe life hande death inſomuch purpoſe v vndertake one thing bycauſe ſtead going forwarde ſhall go backe except god guide v thus ye ſee howe faythfull may comforte themſelues wyth god prouidence true iob miſapplie faying firſt pang fit man may terme hee hath ſpoken heere man deſpayre beholde ſayth know vtterly lorne god hath determined mee thinketh good ſame ſhal accompliſhed ſhall boote mee ſtriue againſt ſurely muſt beginne ende wee ſpeake god ordinaunce let v firſt conſider rightuouſneſſe wee may yeeld due glorie let v imagine ſayd lawleſſe power god wherof haue ſpoken heeretofore make lyke tyrant curſed blaſphemie let v aſſure ſelues god diſpoſing ordering thing vſeth ſoueraine rule iuſtice rightuouſneſſe muſte bee ſquared neuertheleſſe wee muſt theſe vaynglorious folke whiche argue agaynſt god prouidence beginningleſſe election ſee reaſon god doth thing imagin tirannicall blaſphemouſneſſe ſuch men worſe diuels moſt ignorant yet notwithſtanding moſt buſie ſeeking god ſecrets true perchance beare countenance great clerk verie deed ſtarke beaſtes yet need haue god ſhew reaſon doings elſe neuer graunt hee gouerneth thing heere bylowe hee hath chozen hee liſted eternall life making worlde let v keepe ſelues ſuch outrage acknowledging god doings rightful good let v marke woorkes ſhall oftentymes paſſe vnderſtanding yet wee muſt therefore incounter god thing let v conclude good yea ſay ſee reaſon thereof surely whoſoeuer woulde make god ſubiect reaſon dooth hee rob glory god wil rule reaſon fountaine rightuouſneſſe therefore let v hold ſelues contented ſo milde ſay god willeth thing whiche rightfull indifferent know generally ſaid iuſtice rightuouſneſſe let v know alſo god ſo gracious vnto v ioyne knit iuſtice ſaluation lyke hee hath matched mightineſſe alſo vvhen ſay god almightie honour alſo reſt vpon wee may bee inuincible agaynſt temptation inaſmuch god mightie power infinite hee well mainteyne preſerue v like cace rightuouſneſſe seeing inſeparable knot betwene god iuſtice ſaluation let v begin poynt ende wee ſay god bringeth paſſe ſoeuer liſteth hee perfourme whatſoeuer hath determined v wee may alſo aſſure ſelues thing amiſſe thing ruled wonderfull iuſtice wiſedome furthermore haue breefe familiar expoſition ſaying let v marke god hath foredetermined haue done reſpect euerlaſting ſaluatiō ſoules alſo reſpect preſent life concerning firſt god choſe v child creation world wherevnto eye choozing v onely owne infinite mercie bee adam corrupted lumpe vvherefore preferre v reſt creature ſayth sainct paule ſholing v make v excellent fellowes vvee deſerued caſt away damned god hath vouchſafed drawe v deſtruction yee ſee ought glorifie god determination ſomuch pleaſed chooſe v call v ſaluation make v heyres kingdome determination hath beene vttered v lorde ieſus chriſt wee bee member lorde ieſus chriſt bee ſure adoption neede ſeeke regiſters loft heauen let v content ſelues aſſurance hath giuen v man hath copie autentike regiſter content himſelfe ought wee god hath declared purpoſe concerning ſaluation ought ſay reſt vpon yee ſee wiſe behoueth v ſettle ſelues foraſmuch wee bee ſure oure ſaluation vnalterable bycauſe god hath made decree cannot chaunged concerning determination preſent lyfe let v vnderſtande god guideth ſteppes nothing happeneth v caſualtie hee fore ſetteth thing ſo neyther go come thing elſe otherwiſe hee hath ordeyned therefore let v aſſure ſelues ſeeing wee bee ſo god protection wee ſhall well eaſe ſeeing hee watcheth ouer v hath care v let v myſtruſt diuell winde v enimies beſide god prouide v well skill keepe v attemptes ſhall bee made agaynſt v ought onely comfort v alſo giue v courage goe wyth duetie walke euerie man calling miſtruſting god diſappoynt practizes attemptes ſhall bee made agaynſt v breake ſnares men ſhall haue layde catche v goodneſſe ought rauiſh v amaze v wee ſee god hath ſuch care v hath determined thing aboue ſhall done heere beneath vve froggs graſſehoppers prophet eſay ſayth v ſhort wee ſhould like mouse ſtraw prouerbe ſayth god ſet order aforehande ſhoulde become v nowe ſee wee may well ſay knowe god ſauiour father hee hathe ſaluation hande ſuffer mee periſh ought aſſure ſelfe ſeeing hee hathe promiſed iob addeth many lyke thing hee ſhould ſay agaynſt whome bend ſelfe though world ſhould ſet ſelfe agaynſt ſhoulde win nothing mee poore woorme therefore behoueth ſhrinke away surely hee doth well ſo ſaying ſo bee yeelded god honour prayſe rightuouſneſſe yea euen reſpecte affliction hee indured hee ſo combered hys minde acknowledgeth god bee rightuous full equitie hee ought vvhat bee done part wee haue acknowledged ſelues bee cuerie one vnder hande guiding god let v beleeue alſo whole worlde ſo likewiſe diuell ſubiect god thing vvee ſee rage hee commeth agaynſt v ſee alſo howe furious wicked ſort inſomuch may ſeeme ſhould ſwallow v vp great hideous ſtormes come ouer whelme v let v marke therefore god onely keepeth child vnder protection maintaine alſo hee ſo gouerneth whole worlde diuel hee able bring practizes god prouidence alwayes betwene home thus ye ſee howe • ought put doctrine vre nowe finally iob ſayth hee afrayde god hee thinketh vpon ſtandeth doubt hath ſoftned hart ſayth almightie hath amazed reaſon bycauſe hath cut darkneſse hath hidden darkneſſe preſence ſet downe latter part text thus hath hidden cleane contrarie effect iob ment ſay firſt affirmeth hee afrayde god afterward addeth reaſon namely bicauſe god made feele terrible maieſtie wiſe verely ſayth bycauſe know haue mine aduerſarie partie indure mine affliction one knoweth whence come know hande god perſecuteth cauſe ſo afrayde text greatly profite applie ought firſt formoſt without cauſe iob ſayth afrayd god preſence maketh feel maieſtie good reaſon oft thinke vpon god wee ſhoulde bee touched ſtriken feare ſtande awe maieſtie yea although god ſhewe himſelfe louing towardes v allure v maner cocker v little babe yet muſt wee come vnto ſuch ſort muſt alwayes feare lowlineſſe let v marke hath right knowledge god wil willing come yea come deede reioycing hee knoweth father yet notwithſtanding hee alwayes behaue himſelfe lawfully obediently towardes honour cauſe ſayde fifth pſalme lorde enter thy temple vpon multitude thy mercy worſhip feare effect wee haue note heere concerning fearing god maieſtie herewithall let v knowe feare muſt bee ſuch iob ſpeakes witte wee muſt bee ſo afrayde god ſhunne mightie power terrible thing v go hide ſelues haue conceyued ſayde feare wee muſt alſo receyue comfort aſſuring ſelues god minde ſcare v drawe v wee neede bee ſo beaten downe conſidering preſumptuouſneſſe oure nature ſuche pryde v wee neuer yeelde god due honour till oure fleſhe bee vtterly ſubdued tamed howe muſt done euen plaine force owne good wee woulde neuer bee humble meeke god therefore fayne vſe violence behalfe mortifie fleſh may bee broken broozed ſtoupe vntoo thys done hee ſetteth v vp agayne contented ſhewe himſelfe bee father ende wee ſhoulde honour ment wee ſhoulde bee ſtricken ſuche fearefulneſſe wee ſhoulde knowe become wee haue honoured god wyth reuerent awe wee ſhoulde alſo preace vntoo vpon truſt manifolde goodneſſe yet notwithſtanding iob ſpeaketh heere verie notable witte conceyuing ſuch fearefulneſſe bycauſe god ſoftned heart amazed perſecuting heereby iob doth v vnderſtand although alwayes feared god yet notwithſtanding foraſmuch aſſaulted ſuch temptation conceyueth ſuch terrour wiſt manner god nowe importeth two poyntes one oure owne nature wee bee deafe dull ſo wee knowe feare god hath beene ſayde alreadie tyll driue v force yee ſee men become ſtoute lyke murtherers vntill god haue well tamed heereby wee ſee neceſſarye v afflicted otherwiſe would play looce coltes woulde know obey god yeelde ſubiection therefore hee fayne make v afrayde affliction hee ſendeth v marke one poynt faythfull erewhyles ſo aſtoniſhed god iuſtice bee ouerraught yea ſo ouertaken bee vtterly diſmayde little iob howbeeit ende god releeueth well woorthie bee noted diuell vſeth two extremity v one careleſneſſe inſomuch god drawe v ſome violent maner fall aſleepe ſinnes diuell may winne handes well apayd god wakeneth v doth diuell labour driue v diſpayre behoueth v preuent ſuch policy therefore let v learne iob ſtriken ſo great feare like may well betyde v much except lorde mortifie v heerewithall behoueth v marke maner men brought ſayde feare terrour experience ſheweth ſame falleth alwayes proofe therof ſhall ſee many naughtipackes ceaſſe gnaſh teeth againſt god euen hee ſmyteth vppon many blowes dooth god execute vengeance vppon enimies yet notwithſtanding doo amende haue harte whit ſoftned become ſpytefull wicked afore inſomuch thervpon fall kicking ſpurning agaynſt god like reſtie iades seeing affliction cannot alwayes tame ſubdue men take bitte teeth runne heade agaynſt way god would haue go let v lerne thereby without cauſe iob ſayeth heere hee afrayde bycauſe god cut darkeneſſe ſetteth downe darkeneſſe preſence darkneſſe yea worde worde face darkneſſe men haue miſexpounded wiſe god cut miſerie happened mee iob meeneth ſo rather thus▪ god hath cut couert affliction indure vnknowne men oftentymes haue greefe trouble know whence commeth afterward addeth hath hidden darkeneſſe preſence ſome bodie hath corrupted text ſetting downe hee hath hidden whereas contrarywiſe ſayde hee hath hidden darkeneſſe c ſay conſtreyneth come like offender led violence iudge woulde fayne ſcape hee wiſt ſhift himſelfe away hee ſome corner alone woulde cut owne throte become hys owne hangman diſpatching himſelfe yet notwythſtanding muſt ſpite hart appeare iudge heare ſentence condemnation euen ſo doth iob ſhewe hee himſelfe delt ſaye hucker mucker ſayth afflicted cannot ſay ſee miſchaunce god ſheweth himſelfe mine aduerſarie maketh feele whome muſt yeeld mine account hath ſhewed hande notable poynt ſee oftentimes men ſmally touched feare god ſheweth himſelfe affliction report hereof pharao aegyptians dyd god euer vſe ſharper ſcourges thoſe yet notwithſtanding ſeene hardened themſelues agaynſt truely knew time hande god knowledge ſoone vaniſh away ſo dazeled themſelues rather diuel ſo bewitched thought none enemy moiſes aaron god ſhewed full well ſhetteth men vp muſt needes feele hande yea muſt fayne ſpite theyr teeth knowe iudge ſtrong ynough tame yea ouerthrow breake peeces therefore let v pray god ſmite v hand hee ſuffer v fall ſturdineſſe againſt according alſo moyſes ſpeaketh may open eye ſee chaſtiſeth v may ſo blockiſh ſtubborne knowe hande whereas ſayde prophet looked hande ſmote ſhewe v ſtubborne people woonne god ſcourges let v beware ſame happen vnto v let v pray god hee hathe made v feele mightie hande humble v withall ſuffer v bee vnamendable graunt v grace bee ſo ſwallowed vp heauineſſe wee ſhoulde bee ſcared away ſhunne rather ſo drawe v vntoo vppon truſt power bring graue ſo alſo plucke v thence againe may ſay prophete lorde wyll quicken v third daye though wee bee deade tyme yet ſhall bee made alyue agayne hys goodneſſe therefore let v alwayes repayre vntoo hym hathe wounded v aſſuring oure ſelues hee ſoueraine surgion wyll helpe v lorde ieſus chriſtes ſake nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying hym make v ſo feele wee may alwayes returne right vnto hym yea euen ſuche affection minde may bee applyed therevntoo wee beeing aſſured bee fauourable v may call vppon deſiring hee hath forgiuen v ſinnes paſt ſo guide v life whole labour may ſerue glory ſo let v al ſay almighty god heauenly father c xcj sermon first vpon xxiiij chapter hovv tymes hidden almightie hovve ſuche knovv ſee dayes 2 remoue land markes ſome rob ſome fleece flockes ſome feede themſelues vvith 3 otherſome take aſſe fatherleſſe take vviddovves oxe gage 4 turne poore vvay ſo hyde themſelues meeke peſtered togither vpon earth 5 go foorth morning like vvilde aſſes deſert pray vvilderneſſe giueth bread himſelfe child 6 gather harueſt feeldes gather vintage vynes euen vvicked 7 ſpoyle naked man ſo vvalketh vvithout garment colde 8 vvet vvith ſhoures nighte mountaines imbrace ſtone theyr bed 9 fleece fatherleſſe take guage poore matter handled heere hathe beene layd foorth heeretofore another maner howbeit ther nothing may fare better wee conſider well god propoundeth leſſon ſo often v matter god executeth iudgementes vewe eye ſo might ſeene hee hath care good maynteyne enemie wicked puniſh haue deſerued vvee ſee thing order world true iob hath hilde long talke afore know ſuch ſo great ſtumbling blocke troubled continually yea euen perfecteſt v miſcheefe indure god remedye euery v greeued wee fall diſputing howe ſhoulde poſsible god ſhoulde ſo pacient diſſemble ſo muche ſeeme aſleepe letteth thing alone ſort therefore neede ſtabliſhed leſſon conteyned heere often put minde ende wee ſee thing turmoyled worlde wee may alwayes haue ſuch light faith may ſerue v ſee god iudgementes although hidden v nowe ſo poynte iob intendeth ſhewe heere god hideth iudgementes time neither executeth vengeance vpon wicked deliuereth godly firſt brunt ſuffereth endure many wrong proofe heereof ſayth howe time hidden almightie ſuche knowe ſee dayes vvee haue ſeene heeretofore eliphas bare v hande god iudge worlde ſuch wiſe euery man might perceyue thinketh vpon thoſe ſerue hym hathe eye vppon reacheth hande continuallye ſide wicked puniſhed hande cleane contrary ſayeth iob proofe heereof ſeene full robberie might ouercommeth right haue taken paynes eate labor handes goodes plucked force seeing good ſo troubled vexed bad ſo hardned yet ſcape vnpuniſhed god ouerſlips though paſſed theſe worldly matter ſhould man ſay diſſembleth ſhew himſelfe iudge till hee perceiue time ſerue would aske reaſon ſhoulde bee confounded therefore wee muſt conclude god iudgements ſecret wonderfull paſſe man capacitie ſo wit ſhall fayle v behalfe therefore muſt reuerence ſecrets god vnknowen v acknowledging bee righteous though find doings ſtrange many haue troubled themſelues greatly firſte parte ſentence ſayde time hidden god ſeemeth iob blaſphemeth going exclude god gouernment worlde ſayde tymes ment thinges ſubiect chaunge alteration iob ment ſay god gouerneth well worlde generall medleth particular ordering aud guiding thing ſeueralitie farre naturall meening neede ſeeke elſewhere expoſition gloze text ſelfe ſayde time hidden vvhat meeneth iob hee ſheweth himſelfe ſaying howe whyche knowe god perceyue dayes vve knowe thoſe termed dayes god wherein hee vttereth ſheweth hymſelfe god puniſheth wicked ne deliuereth good heareth requeſts firſte wee bee darke god ſeemeth bee hidden withdrawne worlde ſeparate himſelfe let go hauocke bee ſhorte excepte god make v feele prouidence prooue vnto v openly hee gouerneth aboue beneath bee night tyme becommeth darke light countenance god hee ſheweth himſelfe father good men preſeruing grace ſide puniſheth wicked worthye ſay whiche inlighteneth v day lorde ſo ſpeaketh holy scripture ſayeth wicked doo reioyce day lorde ſhall bee turned vntoo intoo darkeneſſe light ſhall full feare terrour vvhy ſo vvhen god appeareth wicked muſte needes bee afrayde bycauſe hys preſence ynough ouerwhelme cauſeth wicked bee ſo ſtubborne mocke threatnings go forwarde wicked affection bycauſe ſeemeth bee ſcaped god hande god ſheweth himſelfe muſte needes bee abaſſhed ſpite teeth let v returne text ſayd god dayes ſeene know ſay good mē truſt god wayting help ſaluation hath promiſed ſo cannot firſt brunt perceyue hee helpe ſeeke yet dwell ſtill ſuſpence though calling vpon booted thus ye ſee godly cannot ſee god preſence ſay cannot perceyue hand experience god neere ſuch ſort ſelfe declareth ſaying hee alwayes ready heere ſuch call vpon truth wee haue true meening ſentence witte god hyding time hee executeth hys iudgements euery minute houre bycauſe delayeth prolongeth ſo meane perceyue hys dayes adayes may ſeeme god hath care v hee hath ſeparated withdrawne himſelfe v bycauſe hys prouidence knowne v true god ſeeth marketh thing dayly hath eye blindfolded yet ſeemeth ſo oure vnderſtanding according scripture woont applye ſelfe rudeneſſe infirmitie men god therefore hathe hys tyme wyll ſhewe ſeeth thing hee perceyueth preſently bycauſe wee ſide able diſcerne hee hathe care men nowe hee hath eye open note marke euill committed redreſſe ſame vve ſee reſpect perceyuerance ſome certaine time hidden men howbeit well knowne vntoo god ſay god delayeth iudgements executeth firſt daſhe thus much concerning ſenſe letter nowe let v aduiſe ſelues gather ſuche inſtruction gyuen v thys ſentence haue ſayd already ſore temptation faythfull thing confuzed world ſo may ſeeme god medleth fortune ruleth gouerneth thing hath beene cauſe theſe diueliſhe prouerbes thing toſſed caſuall fortune thing blindly guided god playeth men tennisball ther neither reaſon meaſur doings rather thing gouerned certaine ſecret neceſsitie god vouchſafeth thinke vpon v behold blaſphemies haue raigned time haue ſayd already man wit dazeled goeth iudge thing order paſſe iudgement reaſon vvhat bee done let v armed againſt ſuch ſtumblingblocks god ſheweth himſelfe iudge ſeemeth rather bee ſhutte vp heauen take hys paſtime bee vnwilling deale affayres heere yet let v holde thys certayntie hee ceaſſeth doo office howbeeit ſecret faſhion vnknowen vnto v althoughe hys iudgements bee wonderfull yet let v ceaſſe honour humilitie acknowledging bee rightuous wayting hys leyſure paciently till hee ſhewe v cauſe hee maketh ſuche delay ſame ſeeme ſtraunge v lette v bethinke v whyche hathe beene handled heeretofore oure mindes ſo frowarde wilfull wee turne god workes quite vpſide downe neuer take profite god hilde ſuche order aſſoone man hath offended hee ſhould bee puniſhed according offence good ſhould liue heere peace reſt hope ſhould euerlaſting life would neuer brought paſſe ſhould bee plucked bylow god gaue v peaſable perfect ſtate wherein nothing miſliked would bee fayth wee woulde hope endleſſe life wee would imagine reſurrection thus ye ſee men might perceyue god iudgements according owne deſire would fall aſleepe heere low faſt tied world much better thing ſhould order end wake v might liue eaſe wee woulde fall aſleepe wee ſhoulde haue neyther vnderſtanding thyng elſe thing go amiſſe bee compelled thynke vppon god lift vp oure wittes highe conſider iudgement prepared ſhewed yet meane whereby oure lorde leadeth v longing latter day reſurrection hee hathe promiſed v yet notwithſtanding men ceaſſe intangle themſelues many falſe wicked imagination haue ſayd already bycauſe thing fall wee woulde haue tempted ſurmyze god thinketh vpon v ne regardeth v tyme loſt ſerue hym one lyue well yll good men gayne nothing walking feare vnder hym lo howe men ruſhe intoo vngodlineſſe bycauſe lorde ruleth iudgementes appetite might brooke according reaſon fanſie vvherefore let v learne onely diſtruſt owne fleſhly wiſdome alſo knowe ſame enemie god wiſedome wee muſt gyue libertie whiche deuiſe ſelues muſt minde well doctrine conteyned heere god iudgements hidden men ſurmount wee conceyue owne brayne ſmall meaſure conteyne infinite thing alſo cauſe holy scripture termeth god iudgementes vnſearchable deepe cannot bee ſounded therefore behoueth v call thys minde may holde v awe ſo wee may bee diſcreete ſober ende aduaunce ſelues muche waite god leyſure till vtter vntoo v thing yet hidden beholde marke whereat muſt ſhoote wee mind gather good profitable inſtructiō ſentence let v mark alſo iniquitie raigne ther redreſſe ſame muſt ſeeme ſtraunge v hath beene ſo time certayne wee compare ſtate iobs time ſtate much ſoundneſſe wee know world growes worſe worſe men harden euill corruption increaſeth yet ſame complaynts made iobs time made heere namely rich men seagulfs ſwallow vp thing ate vp fatherleſſe robbed widdowes nothing crueltie againe poore taken paynes yea preſſed theyr oyle houſes yet men ceaſſe ſpoyle theyr goodes gathered grape yet fayne go awaye athirſt wine drawne awaye hand yea crueltie extended ſo farre poore folke ſtripped clothes faine go away ſtarke naked ſteade beddes pyllowes fayne lye vpon harde ſtones ſleepe rayne deaw night winde colde ſuche cruelty time iob ſhall wee maruell many outrage committed ſtrongeſt go awaye thyngs force bee reaſon equitie vprightneſſe among men wilde beaſtes nowe adayes world ouerfloweth naughtineſſe wee come full toppe iniquitie ſaye wee muſte thynke ſtraunge ſee muche rightuouſneſſe thoſe dayes yet ſuche extortion intermedled true theſe thing harde v comprehende neuertheleſſe written vayne ende wee ſhoulde receyue inſtruction whē iniquity raigne ſort euery v ſhould diſpoſe himſelfe pacience beare thing quietly ſeeing pleaſeth god exerciſe v lyke liued aforetimes haue ſhewed way thoſe ſhould come lette v learne ſay prepare ourſelues ſuche thing yea take paciently muſt reſemble wicked growing hardharted crueltie neyther muſt practiſe curſed prouerbe playing naughtypacks among naughtypackes wee muſt armed pacience thing cannot done vnleſſe firſt conclude ſelues ſeing god hath permitted much extortion outrage naughtineſſe crueltie raigne age muſt ſhrinke like bee nowadayes paciently tarie till god redreſſe harmes aſſuring ſelues ſame ſhall done hād god diſſembleth time thing ſeeme hidden ſight hee call ought account therefore behoueth v keepe ſilence meane whyle grudge accuſing god though gouerned world righteouſly elſe vſurp ſuperioritie ouer curſed blaſphemie let v come another point haue marke whiche conſider particularly iniquity iob marketh heere ſome thing ſeeme excuſable firſte ſight ſayth riche men take pledge fatherleſſe take away aſſes force take ox poore widdowes well hath beene ſayde heeretofore lawfull matter take gage pledge permitted ſo common weales yea let v marke god gaue people leaue take gage lending money condition poore ſhoulde bee greeued meaſure ſhould robbed goodes taking poore man bed ſuch ſort ſhould fayne lye ſtrawe haue declared alreadye behold heere crueltie puniſhed mennes hand yet ſhall fayle come account god bee regiſtred vp tyll reſidue haue pitie theyr neyghbours ſhall knowe alſo iuſtice ſhall executed vpon without mercie yea though poore folke deſire vengeance god hand yet fayle according affirmeth moyſes ſides colde ſhal crye though partie hold peace beare thing certainly god beholdeth poore man pitie condemnation hath beene ſo cruel ſo naught among cruelty committed iobs time hee rehearſeth expreſſely riche men tooke gage fatherleſſe widdowes yea euen ſuche gage neceſſary ſuſtenance example fatherleſſe childe hathe aſſe laboure withall taken muche man ſhoulde ſnatch bread mouth againe widdowe hathe cowe yeeldes hir milke buie bread withall thys bee taken hir ſhee robbed left naked though thys bee counted robberie afore men puniſhable among yet muſt come reckning god moreouer althoughe wee alledge neuer ſo many excuſes yet conuicted wee ſelues ſhall bee oure owne iudges howe dooth god execute office compariſon vvhen wee ſee poore fatherleſſe childe readye beg bread another man ſpoyling goodes wee ſee poore widow oppreſſed muſt bee greeued moued ſay crueltie vvee mortall creature wretched earthly wormes perceyue euill condemne pray god blynd haue eye ſhet although men laboure hide themſelues many ſtartingholes yet ſhall alwayes haue ſuche inſight harte muſt needes diſcerne betweene good euill euen theyr owne iudgementes vnderſtand muſte fayne come heauēly iudge ſeeth much clearely doo way wee muſte marke alſo howe ſayde heere boundes meeres buttelles remoued whiche greate diſorder boundes meeres buttelles ſerue ſeuer landes heritage like money common fine ſerueth traffike among men money occupie one another thing true money coyned men might well haue ſome trade occupying togyther exchaunge ſuche playne dealing nowadayes neyther coulde put vre ſo vntowarde time men ſee money coyned goeth abroade hand hande ſuretie warrant men terme men may occupie one another beſides alſo boundes meeres buttelles whiche ſerue feeldes landes theſe certaine continuall bee good neighbourhod among v oure life ſhall diſordered thā life brutiſhe wild beaſts yet notwithſtanding ſee long ago hath beene ſuche craftineſſe maliciouſneſſe chaunging boundes falſifying thing ought holy among men therefore according haue ſayde already boundes meeres buttelles bee kept inuiolable ſurely go ſpoyle hauocke wyll bee nothing worlde catch catch may vve ſee hath beene aforetymes ende wee might bee better ſtrengthned againſte ſuche ſtumbling blockes yet notwithſtanding time cannot iuſtifye ſuche doo amiſſe behoueth v marke poynt many thinke ſheeld themſelues alledging thing haue beene woonted bee ſo haue beene long continuance pray doo knowe nowadayes ſuche plucke vp buttelles woorſe theeues vve may well iudgement although wee god lawe scripture yet written harte miſlike vtterly ſuche falſehood man alledge hath beene vſed afore hath beene practiſed three thouſand yeares ſufficient iuſtifie ſuche deface boundes thys day ſo maye ſaye haue beene poſſeſsion long time therefore let v learne harden ourſelues example whiche ſee men beginne doo euill greeue god others followe ſo ſhoulde ſeeme might doo liſt cuſtome become lawe let v fall aſleepe vpon god rule al right altreth loke hath ordeyned muſt continue euer men workes muſt layde ſquire ſquared man ſooner ſwarue aſide ſhall bee condemned vvherefore let v marke well men faultes miſdoings growne cuſtome muſt ſay may follow bycauſe woonted thing among men let v alwayes haue eye vnto god ſayde hath ſtabliſhed rule ſhall chaunged althoughe men turne fro thing ſeeme vtterly oute order yet ſhall god rightuouſneſſe continue euermore inuiolable full force therefore let v learne gather ſelues home paciently walke feare god haue eye ſayde vprightneſſe hee commaundeth v ſayde afterwarde poore ſhette vp made turne way wicked ſcope ſteade hyding themſelues • oyſted ſtreetes hilde pauement owne poſſeſsion ſeene nowadayes euer yet notwithſtanding wee bee warned ſee iuſtice ſo party haue charge repreſſe lewde dealing ſit god ſeate hold ſword mace iuſtice theyr hand dutie muſt ouermuch offended true wee ought firſt right ſorie ſeate whiche ought conſecrated god ſeruice ſo defiled men ſecondly know alſo god doth puniſh v iuſtly ſuffering iuſtice beare ſway ought token vnworthy gouerned therfore becommeth v ſigh ſee offence committed lord iuſtice magiſtrates ſet hāds redreſſe haue ſuch courage ſtoutneſſe ought haue let v learne ſay god puniſheth v meanes foraſmuch god name blaſphemed thereby let greeue v let v ſorie howbeit withall wee muſt conclude end ſith god cauſeth thing bee ſet perfection preſently muſt needes looke hee ſhall ſhewe himſelfe iudge latter day alſo wee muſt arme oure ſelues againſt ſuche ſtumblingblockes wee ſee wicked take ſuche libertie beate one bounce another doo many wrong outrage yet remedie againſt wee bee newe top beginne agayne good men fayne keepe mouthes ſhette go houſes folke mocke ſo bee fayne keepe themſelues cloſe priſoners vvhen ſee well let v pray god vouchſafe haue pitie v vtter power ſee men bee colde howbeeit hee delay thing fall wee woulde haue let v honour hys ſecrete iudgementes yee ſee cauſe written rightuouſe ſhall bee ſhette vp ſhall dare ſhewe heades abroade muſte bee fayne hide themſelues bee hylde priſoners therewithall let v marke becommeth wicked howe men winke theyr lewdneſſe puniſhe conuenient tyme gather ſuch boldeneſſe dare ſhewe themſelues open ſtreete make theyr tryumphes vvoulde god wee ſawe example hereof nowe adayes scarcely ſhall honeſt man go abroade ſtreetes ſhall flowted ſcoft vexed troubled aſſayled dare ſcarcely mainteyne owne good quarell meane done gallowclappers ought haue beene hanged halfe dozen yeares afore muſt go perking vp neb yea ſo ſtoutly offer ſhame euery priuate perſone alſo whole ſtate iuſtice good man hath cauſe go either alone wyth company one ruſſian ſhall come face hym ſhameleſſe countenance hee muſt ſuffered indured ſpite god man openly wee haue marke wicked puniſhed firſte ought bee become ſo ſtately ouermayſter poore ſimple ſorte ruſhe intoo vngraciouſneſſe becomming ſo bolde good men fayne hide themſelues priſon dare ſpeake worde vvhen wee ſee ſay let v tarie paciently till god redreſſe neuertheleſſe ought warne ſuche publike authoritie duetie carefully woorke ſuch ſtoutneſſe may bee guiltie ſo extreeme diſorder confuſion ſpoken heere elſe theſe dealing muſte returne vpon theyr heades ſhall onely beare peece burthen alſo muſt bee vtterly ouerwhelmed thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke ſayde wicked ryſe betymes go theyr buſineſſe namely go ſtealing robbing ſayeth hee lyke wylde • ſſes whiche light verie nimble beaſts heere hee doth v wit feete malictous cankerdharted ſort ſwift running ſhed bloud doo manner miſcheefe diligence one greateſt vertues god gyueth vntoo men neuertheleſſe behoueth men knowe ende bee created may applie themſelues therevntoo beſtowe theyr cunning abilitie ſame vve knowe ſayde pſalme concerning god order ryſing sunne hee ſounded trumpette ſhyneth vntoo v ende euerie man ſhoulde go worke buſineſſe therby ſhewe v hee hath made v bee ydle vnprofitable applye oureſelues ſomewhat wherein god neighbour may bee ſerued ye ſee sunne rayſer v vp vnto god may diligent duetie men oftentimes diligent bee buzie wyll ryſe earely ynough doo quaf • e fill paunche runne intoo manner diſorder ſayde prophete eſay day long ynough make ende riotting finally ſo wearie play brute beaſtes throughout ſleepe daye watche night ſo order nature turned vtterly vpſide downe ſort ryſe earely purpoſe woorke ſome treacherie lewdneſſe neighbor deceyue one intangle another another ſorte go whorehuntings another ſort theyr wicked buying ſelling thus ye ſee wherein moſte men beſtowe theyr diligence thys ſhewed v expreſly ende wee might knowe wherevntoo wee ſhoulde applye therefore ſoone sunne riſeth let v learne thanke god lightning v ſort ſo wee may beſtirre handes ſay imploy ſelues thing ſoeuer calleth vstoo wherein ſo euer haue v ſerue hym agayne let onely marke ſhoote alwayes know wherevnto calleth v thing alloweth let v ware wee abuſe light sunne diligentneſſe god hathe gyuen v applying hurt oure neighbour man wrong diſpleaſure nay rather ſith ſee theeues vvhoremongers drunkard ſo foreward euill let v learne finde fault owne ſlouth goodneſſe one ſtirringeſt man world doo go murther man giuē drunkenneſſe gluttonie layes himſelfe graue dead ſee theſe drunkard ſtinking carions halfe rotten aboue ground good cauſe wage receyue theyr double diligence glutting thēſelues abuſing good creature god another ſort go whorehuntings otherſome theeuing robbing although theſe kind men thinke aduauntage themſelues yet diligence deſtruction haue toyled themſelues throughly ſhall nothing elſe gather ſtacke wood end fire god wrath ſhall put cōſume▪ quite cleane therefore ſee deſpizers god wicked ſorte ſo diligent euill pray great ſhame v wee bee lazie though armes broken shall euen bee witneſſes againſt v ſo vnprofitable thus ye ſee thing haue marke ſentence warneth v diligent howbeeit ſo take heede apply ſame diligence god haue v beſtow thereof let v haue eye good wee ſhould communicate one another help neighbour euery man conſider abilitie meane hath wherewith ſuccour ſuch haue neede lo diligence ought furthemore let v walke child light ſith god doth inlighten v bothe day night let v call vpon ſigh vnto night day time ſendeth v sunnelight ſo ſee haue duetie is▪ let v apply ſelues faithfully therevntoo leaſtwiſe let v forward thoſe ſo giue thē ſelues euill leaſt become witneſſes ſlouthfulneſſe although ſee god puniſh hand yet let v fully perſwade ſelues horrible vengeance prepared ſheweth ſelfe yet let v therefore ceaſſe looke farre behoueth fayth mount aboue thing ſeene beholde thing ſeene beholde thing hidden thus ye ſee may profite ſelues euen miſorders ſeene world vntill oure lorde bring thing againe ſtate perfection ſhall till laſt day nowe let v fall downe▪ face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying hym make v feele ſuch wiſe hee puniſhe v time wicked wee may yet perceiue hee ſpareth v beareth v wee bee vtterly ouerthrowne although haue deſerued ſo delt yet may ceaſſe haue recourſe vnto ſeeing calleth v ſo gently freendly may indeuer amende vice fleſhe ſory ſo may wholly frame ſelues good call ſelues fully home vnto thereby may proue ſelues childrē reuerence father ſo much greater affection may pleaſe graunt grace c xcij sermon ſecond vpon xxiiij chapter 10 make naked man go vvithout clothing take gleanings hungrie 11 preſſe oyle vvithin vvalles tread vvinepreſſe ſuffer thirſt 12 men crie citie ſoule vvounded ſhevveth ſelfe god putteth ſtop 13 among thoſe hate light knovving vvayes thereof neyther continue path 14 murtherer ryzeth early murthereth poore needie night lyke theefe 15 eye adulterer longeth euening ſaying eye ſhall ſee mee hee hideth face 16 entereth houſes night vvhich marked day agreeth vvith light 17 light morning ſhadovve death man knovv terrour ſhadovv death 18 light vpon vvaters portion curſed vpon earth ſee frute vineyardes iob goeth forwarde ſhe wing ſtate ſeene world withoute redreſſe prouiding god ſerueth proue god iudgernentes alwayes viſible apparant firſt brunt menne ought holde themſelues quiet till lord ſtretch hande bycauſe hee knoweth fit time doo v appoint nowe iob alledgeth worlde ſo full rakehelles poore go naked ſuche haue gleaned haue bit bread eate men ſnatch away euen litle gleaned rich men leaning vvhereby ſignifieth ſuch haue wherewith abuſe credite rich conſume poore vtterly outrageous thing yet god prouideth notwithſtanding hee iudge world thys might trouble v firſt ſight according ſee many ſurmize god aſleepe worketh lyking behoueth v fully perſwaded haue foreſeene long afore ende bee troubled offended come paſſe hath euer beene ſo yet god hath ceaſſed bee iudge worlde howbeeit time ſeeme bee hidden bycauſe ſee hys day hande true knoweth thing yet hydeth himſelfe ſay hee ſheweth hymſelfe willing haue care ſuccour ſuche afflicted tryeth theyr pacience time iob hath ſayd ſo addeth ſuche haue taken paynes yea haue gotten wherewith releeue themſelues cannot inioy owne goodes man ſayeth hee bath preſſed oyle within walles man bathe troden wine ſhall ceaſſe bee athirst true oftentymes happeneth god iuſt puniſhment according alſo ſee howe threatned lawe thou ſhalt plant tree eate theyr frute thou ſhalt till earth ſowe corne reape harueſt thou ſhalte dreſſe vine drinke wine vvhen lorde ſpeaketh manner bycauſe meeneth leaue thing order worlde contrariwiſe hee threatneth puniſh thoſe haue vſed benefites well yet wee ſide cannot alwayes ſee wyth eye god diſſembleth matter vvhen ſome pill poll otherſome ſpoyled theyr ſubſtance wee cannot ſee reaſon god alſo intendeth humble v wee might honour confeſſe bee rightuous verely ſo dazeled cannot diſcerne intendeth ſo ye ſee whereat iob amed hee ſhoulde ſay vvee ſee thoſe dye hunger thirſt whiche haue laboured ſore meane whyle men robbe theyr goodes eaſie god redreſſe hee dooth therefore wee muſt conclude god woorketh ſuche manner knowne vntoo v within compaſſe oure vnderſtanding hathe woonderfull purpoſe whych paſſeth man reache ſo wee bee blynded wee muſt go meaſure god dooings reaſon ſhoulde enter bottomleſſe deepe wee muſte pray graunt v grace content ſelues ſheweth v wee muſt haue ſoberneſſe modeſtie walke ignorance till hee diſcouer thing fully v behoueth v keepe ſelues within owne tedder play loo • e coltes bee neyther way path v thus iobs intent ſhewe v god iudgements ruled man diſcretion ſecret hidden v cauſe hee addeth men crye citie ſoule wounded namely dying lament aud god putteth ſtoppe god doth vnreaſonable thyng later part may taken two wayes truely ſome expounde god receyueth prayer two hebrewe wordes namely ſignifieth ſtop let hinderance impeachment whyche ſignifieth prayer haue ſome likeneſſe neuer latter cannot taken heere prayer ſhould haue beene thephi • whereas nowe thiphla surely confeſſe poynts would ſuffer expoſition would bee moſt conuenient agreeable bycauſe hee ſpeaketh heere cry ſayde men crie wherefore bycauſe bee wrongfully vexed yet god hath regarde theyr complayntes howbeeit tranſlation alſo god putteth ſtoppe fitte notwithſtanding moſte men take another ſenſe namely god doth vnreaſonable thing ſurely ſayde woorde commonly holy scripture put ſignification witte thing well ruled hath foundation whyche hathe truth ſelfe rather vnhoneſt condemned true ſignification moſt common scripture eye muſte bee circumſtance ſentence iob meeneth proue heere god doings grounded vpon reaſon vprightneſſe howbe eit hee doo verely acknowledge ſo diſcourſe hee maketh tendeth another diuerſe ende whiche bee amazed beholde ſtate worlde vvhy v none v would diſpoſe thing cleane otherwiſe therefore thys ordinance gouernement whiche wee ſee wee haue remember god behaueth himſelfe fancie ne executeth hys iudgements ſuche wiſe man might beholde ſay see heere howe god woorketh rather oftentimes hee go couert ſay iobs meening ſo thys ſente • ice muſt bee vnderſtoode men crye citie ſoules ſuche vexed oppreſſed doo mourne yet god ſtoppeth doings thoſe thing ſay letteth thing runne ſtill order yea tyme although hee winke yet hee aſleepe hath binſayde afore therefore behoueth v ſuſpende oure iudgementes make generall rule god puniſheth men ſoone haue done amiſſe ſo iuſtice apparant viſible v vvee ſee heere contrarye iob ſayeth expreſſely men crye citie hee ſhoulde ſaye ſpeake vnknowne faultes maye bee manye deceytes wrong wroughte hudder mudder iniuries notorious whiche knowne ouer citie euery ſtreete ring euery man ſpeakes ſo miſuſed make ſuch outcry many men may witneſſes wrong done beholde neceſsitie ſo extreme appeereth playnly high time helpe neuer readye runne theyr wittes yet god maketh countenance minded helpe ſhould ſeeme cry vayne loſt time men reſort vnto god vvhen men ſee ſhall ſay god worketh maner wittes muſt needes dazeled therefore let v learne honor wiſdome wee cannot comprehende ſay lorde true fleſh nature prouoke v grudge againſt thee yet muſt wee rule thee appetite vvherefore wee waite paciently till thine houre come wilt thou worke thou knoweſt profitable expediēt leſſon wel worthy noted ſee haſtie beſides man touch v finger wee bee ſo wayward calling vpon god v hee help v hād ſoone haue caſt foorth ſome ſigh thinke doth v great wrong seeing ſuch hartburning v paſsions ſo exceſsiue wee haue ſo much neede marke well leſſon ſayd men crie citie yea euen already poynt deathe yet god diſpatcheth theyr ſighing ſorte ſuffereth men tormente ſtill ſeeme ſtraunge v firſt muſt vnderſtande howe oure lorde hathe threatned ſuche haue pitied neyghbours ſhall crie heard themſelues ſayth poore haue deſired ſhew thē mercy came find fauor hand became cruell eares deafe requeſts therfore time wil come ſhall cry man ſhall heare vvhen heare ſuch threatnings god behoueth v looke whether thoſe crie lament haue vſed crueltie towards men ſo reaſon god ſhould puniſh ſo might ſob ſigh yet ſuccoured whereas ſayd cry went vp heauē party cried put extreme paine let v conſider little whither worthie ſo hādled therwithall let v acknowledge god iuſt iudge furthermore cannot bee ſayde god ſuffering v bee ſo oppreſſed puniſhe v may come paſſe ſuche ſo greeued oppreſſed haue alwayes beene gentle louing doone anye ſuch wrong iniurie neighbour maye bee worthy ſuch puniſhment ſay knowne lette v reuerence woonderfull ſecretes god ſith wyll wee ſhould knowe reaſon hee dooth ſo beholde ſaye howe wee ought practize ſentence therefore wee bee afflicted crie vntoo god yet perceyue willingneſſe hym helhe v let v thynke hath forgotten v nother let v hart vvhy hys prouidence paſſeth oure vnderſtanding therefore muſt learne holde ſelues quiet euen wee ſee graue afore v haue cried beſought god haue pitie vpon v yea alſo ſeeme ſhet vp heauen ſo wee perceyue hande gyue v eaſe let v ceaſſe ſue continually ſhall diſappointed oure hope yet notwithſtanding behoueth v mount aboue man vnderſtanding alſo paule ſayth according example abraham ought hope aboue hope vvee haue like marke text ſo long men ſelfewiſe impoſsible truſt god reſt vpon goodneſſe vppon ſaluation promiſed god exerciſe fayth make v bee beſeeged hundred deathes ſo ſhall bee good ſwallowed vp gulfe vvhat done let v learne iudge oure ſaluation looke god hande owne mother wit reaſon ſmall meaſure let v practize leſſon paules hoping againſte hope ſee whit god ſeeth v meane v eſcape god finde meane deathe ſeeming readie catch v god able remedie although know manner yet v ſcan let v god ſo much honor▪ beleeue hee ſaue v beyonde man conceyue yea euen ſuch wiſe wee ſhall compelled rauiſhed woonderment behold alſo ſayd welfare church faythfull bethinke ſort god hath deliuered ſhal take dreame inſomuch thyng cannot bee comprehended man reaſon bycauſe according order nature beholde ſay howe ought keepe ourſelues quiet may reſt vpon god goodneſſe feede ſelues hope promiſes hee hath gyuen v yea wee crie vnto hee maketh likelyhoode hearing v let v ceaſſe continue ſute ſtill hope beyond hope wit beyond ſee diſcerne thus muche concerning text nowe followeth ſuche doo euill ſhunne light bide themſelues theefe alwayes ſeeketh darkneſſe night whē day commeth thinketh ſhadow death aduouterer whorehunter watcheth till euening ſhette hee may ſhrinke intoo brothelhouſe lo men hate light euill purpoſe doth iob ſpeake heere ſhewe v god iudgeth worlde ſuch maner eliphas ſpeaketh wee haue ſayde eliphaſsis meening thing ruled ſuche wiſe bylow men may perceiue god guideth gouerneth thing true wee may well perceyue howbeit mother wit faith muſte bee fayne reigne behalfe wee muſt looke preſent viſible thing ſayth iob heere beholde ſayth hee howe menne condemne themſelues ſinne yet condemned god ſight worlde ſay god executeth vengeance vpon firſt daſh letteth alone quiet men therefore compelled accuſe themſelues make owne indytement condemne themſelues god ſpareth ment god reſerueth greater iudgement himſelfe meane hee ſuffereth thing bee partly order intent wee ſhoulde drawe aloft vnderſtand tyme wherin muſt exerciſed many battels temptation thys tyme trouble thing lift v vp withall repoſing truſt god worde ſo wee walke owne fancie reſt vpon thing bee ſeene nowe next way make v ſwarue aſide ryght reaſon effect whereat iob ameth therefore let v marke well howe ſayd ſuch ſeeke darkneſſe night work naughtineſſe ſorie ſee day appeere ſhadowe death true ſomtimes men become ſo ſhameleſſe ſticke doe euill high noone dayes ſaide prophet reſemble harlottes vncouer legges haue neyther ſhame diſcretion diſcerne good euill ſorie ſayth sainct paule salomon ſpeaketh whē come bottome deſpize god honeſtie become brute beaſts diſcerne betweene good euill yet doth god leaue ſome track whereby bee forced condemne owne ſinnes ſpite teeth wee neyther scripture lawe pollicie anye thing elſe let v looke vpon ſayd heere namely menne purpoſe vpon euill finde ſome meanes hide themſelues conclude euill euill ſame condemned vvhat maketh man ſhunne ſight worlde hee would take pleaſure whoredome robberie drunkenneſſe wantonneſſe ſuch like thing could find heart glorie
