wickedneſſe make vertne yet neuertheleſſe hee hydeth himſelfe vvhat conſtreyneth ſo ſayd ſome one man doth ſo man elſe conſent euill behold whole worlde full vngraciouſneſſe ſeene verie ofte men make compactes togither ſuche giuen ſome vice deſire nothing ſo much haue men doe themſelues doe yet notwithſtanding well one hyde themſelues go naughtineſſe would faine lewdneſſe might neuer knowne hereby wicked ſhewe certaine lawe euen nature aboliſhed yea diſcerning good euill much ſee muſt force conclude god iudge hee hath printed ſuch feeling men hart aſhamed ſorie ſinnes commes owne good yet ſhunne light sunne whereas ought rather ſhunne light god iudgement vve ſee men beſotte themſelues wilfully would faine rock conſciences aſleepe might haue feeling think vpon god haue doone muſte ſpite teeth enter themſelues bee hilde faſt brydle ſay conſciences haue ſinned wote excuſe fault ſith ſee muſt conclude god iudgeth worlde commeth men ſhould neuer haue conſideration ſelues bee wounded ſinnes bee ſorie excepte god conſtrayned force nowe god inforce men conſciences ſort ſeare ſearing yron making haue burning fire within thinke wee hee muſt one day call men take reckening thing lay open regiſters ſayd daniell diſcouer thing lie buried darkneſſe paule ſayth corinthians▪ ſhame wicked haue ſame alone ſufficient infallible proof god iudgement ſo much muſt faine come iohn ſayth namely god greater conſciences vvhen iohn hath ſayde euery man enter owne conſcience hee needeth none witneſſe aduerſarie accuſe himſelfe ſhall finde owne miſdeed bee ſufficiently conuinced freendes ſayth perceyue owne ſinnes yea euen whether wee ſhall god thinke hee blinde wee ſelues ſo cleereſighted hath much power conſciences haue man condemne himſelf one ſinne muſt conclude damnable god hundred finde himſelfe aſtoniſhed afrayde euill howe ſhall hee bee able beare god horrible vengeance prepared v wee continue wilfully ſinnes behold heere leſſon moſt neceſſarie leaſt put vre haue ſayde alreadie men one ſparke reaſon though remorſe ſhame haue ſinnes yet ſhould bee conuicted could ſcape hande god ſurely ofte wee ſee man wilfully giuen doe euill feele ſinnes one god ſummoned v iudgement conſtreyned v think vpon done yere haue infinit examination euerie day inſomuch haue ſoner offéded thing ſaid mo • ſe ſayd ſting pricketh v much god ſhould ſende purſiuant v ſay yee muſt appeare lord iudge vvee ſee number ſuche haue doone amiſſe labour couer ſinnes verie cunning bycauſe know ſinne damnable behold god warneth v yet regardeth men wilfully harden heart againſte god warning may well ſayde satan hath bewitched v yes yet beſide ſuche warning god ſheweth v worde faultes maketh v feele draweth v himſelfe yet wee ceaſſe welter ſtill owne filth growe ſenſleſſe hereby therefore appeereth leſſon verie yll put vre yet written vaine haue ſayde well worthie bee marked reſpecte ſelfe ſay much men labour excuſe iuſtifie ſelues euill dooings yet bring paſſe ſtandeth euerie one v hand awake conſider ſhall gaine nothing colouring thing ſerue eſchue reproch worlde man haue ſpent night ſecretly whoredome haue gone theeuing haue beguiled neighbour haue ſhet doores practize ſome treaſon truly menne condemne till lewdneſſe bee knowne abroade eſchue preſence god furthermore let v marke well howe apoſtle telleth v worde god two edged ſworde entereth bone maree ſo nothing hidden god examineth v thoughtes affection appoynteth worde preached vnto v alſo let v adde leſſon paule giueth v ſith wee haue goſpell enlighten v child darkneſſe light suche haue god worde thinke haue made fayre hand ſinne buried come remembrance god doth ſo inlighten v doctrin haue daylight night according ſayde sunne ſhall ſhine vpon church daye moone night lorde ſhall continuall light truly order nature continueth always ſtate yet therewithall let man lay himſelfe bed ſhet himſelfe chamber hide himſelfe ſo cloſe man may knowe hee ſayth doth yet doctrine goſpell doth alwayes ſhine vpon quench knowledge god hath giuen doubt although ſcornefull heatheniſh ſort labour ſee howe mad beaſtes theſe dayes ſeeke mothing aboliſhe religion yet god haue ſayde lampe worde burne alwayes maye perceyue owne damnation ſeeing god hathe giuen v doctrine goſpell brightneſſe whereof wee dimme let v bethinke ourſelues vnderſtand theeues whoremaſters euill dooers ſeeke couert teache v howe ought walke ſeeing god v preſent hee ſheweth himſelfe open face eyther father iudge vvherefore let v learne dedicate whole life vnto whereas wee ſee ſuch would couer euill dooing ſhunne light ſhadowe death glad night commeth let v vſe light giuen v keepe v ſtraying waye ſwaruing aſide ſpecially ſeeing lord calleth v reacheth hande drawe v thus ye ſee howe wee ought profite ourſelues grace god giueth v making v know ſinnes wretchedneſſe meanes goſpell furthermore let v marke like wicked doe hate light day could find heart sunne plucked skie ende myght alwayes haue freedome euill ſo much ſhunne light goſpell heere ye ſee alſo cauſe ſame doctrine goſpell ſo yll receiued world lord ieſus chriſt ſayth wonder howe men ſhould bee ſo ſtubborne againſte god ſpecially ſeeing ſendeth ſonne redeemer offereth v forgiueneſſe ſinnes deſiring v great gentleneſſe freendlineſſe howe many ſay men ſhould bee ſo ſtubborne forſake goodneſſe god outrageous churliſhneſſe yes certainly behold reaſon world hateth goſpell bycauſe ſauiour chriſte ſayth ſo euer doth euill hateth light cace ſtandeth ſo moſt men giue themſelues euill yea ouen conuicted wilfulneſſe ceaſſe harden themſelues would faine ſhet eye ſpite god heart ſeeing ſo wonder men bee loth taſt goſpell byte rather play mad bedlems ought thought ſtrange ſee theeues murtherers whoremonger euill doer could wel find heart haue sunne darkened ſhould ſhine world haue ſayde brightneſſe goſpell yet farre greater ſerueth gyude eye ſhew v way outwardly entreth euen oure ſecrete thoughtes muſt examine hidden verie bottome heart yee ſee wicked loth come doctrin frame thēſelues mean vnto yet muſt ſide deale cleane contrariwiſe haue ſayde alreadie therefore touching order nature god maketh daiſunne ſhine let v vnderſtand ende euerie man ſhould giue himſelfe goodneſſe dutie marke one point againe wee ſhall haue walked according calling ſtate euery mā ſeruing god neighbor day long let v aſſure ſelues wee muſt abuſe darkeneſſe night libertie dooing euill lampe god worde neuer goeth haue declared alreadie therefore day night let v bee child light let v awake inlightned saint paule ſayth ſay let v fall aſleepe ſoothing ſelues ſinnes neyther let v thinke ſelues innocent god rather let euerie one v quicken vp himſelfe drowned owne conceit ſo ſhould bee paſt ſhame euill let v bee ſober onely eating drinking alſo al deſires luſtes let v ſo bridle may cut al ſuperfluous concupiſcences drawe v vnto euill thus ye ſee effect haue marke ſentence herevnto iob addeth ende wicked lightfooted vpon water glyde away yet go graue like earth drieth ſaith hee heate sunne ſucketh vp ſnowe moysture doth graue ſwallowe vp wicked ſeemeth iob ſheweth god puniſheth euill deed done worlde agreed eliphas meening farre otherwiſe intent ſhewe effecte wicked periſhe ſuch wiſe man perceiue god hand apparantly vpon ſay behold god puniſheth ſuch man cauſe hath liued amiſſe contrariwiſe wicked ſoke away like water leaue remembrance themſelues behinde goe graue yea ſo doe good men ſee howe iob concludeth god doth ſo execute iuſtice puniſhing ſins men may alwayes ſeene heerewithall let v call mynde howe hath bene ſayde afore iob blaſphemeth god make himſelf beleue prouidence thing ruled fortune god meane ſetteth aſleepe heauen intent ſhewe god iudgementes alwayes viſible behooueth v beare well mynde ſaying ſet alwayes eye verie profitable doctrine haue ſhewed heretofore yet hath need repeated newe againe good greatly troden vnder foote long pining die time yet owne opinion haue liued long life nothing elſe cōtinull conſumptiō vve ſee eye meane becommeth wicked haue deſpized god bin full outrage crueltie naughtineſſe aſſoone good dayes paſt die yea euen water ſoketh away man ſhall perceiue god vttereth certaine marke vengeance vpon death gentle eaſie vvhen man ſees ſay great ſtumbling blocke ſuche iudge naturall reaſon ſee lorde doth alwayes puniſh wicked letteth goe common traine afterwarde die ſeene common generall men yet muſt therefore ſurmize ſcaped ſhall abyde vnpuniſhed muſt haue eye iudgement wee looke according promiſes holie scripture aſſuring ſelues lorde calleth v thither executeth iuſtice full onely part giue v ſome inckling may ſerue ſhewe v thing yet brought right order end ſhould hope comming lord ieſus chriſt ſo much heartely long redeemer thus ye ſee doone vvhen ſee tyrant beare ſway innocent bloud ſhed whoredome looceneſſe reigne wrong outrage violence committed poore folke troden men feete ſet vpon throat thing ſhuffled togither ſuch hotchpotche wee wote ſay let v confeſſe ſaying vvell lorde thing ordered would wiſh ſhould hope comming lord ieſus chriſt reſurrection promiſed v heauenly kingdome ſhould bee alreadie paradiſe nowe toſſed raging ſea midſt ſtormes whirlewindes ſerueth well teach v long reſt prepared v heauen thou haſt promiſed v end may haue ſight alwayes faſtned vpon comming lord leſus chriſt thy sonne ſhall gather v himſelfe according thou haſt committed v charge protection guyding furthermore ſee wicked nowadayes hide ſelues euill let v aſſure ſelues yet wee hide ſelues preſence oure god although ſhunne sunnelight yet wee ſhunne ſight ſearcheth heart vvhat done foraſmuch gain nothing ſeking lurking hole ſhun preſence god ſo would good come ſight whereas wicked eſchue mocke threatnings made iuſtice let v ſeke nothing come god ſeeing ſo gracious v make v owne indges let v tarie condemned hand ende may quit let v yeelde ſelues giltie owne accorde ye ſee may put ſentence vre learne condemne ourſelues wee come ſhewe ourſelues god come vpon truſt promiſe receyue ſuche mercie ſorie ſinnes ſeeke nothing elſe grace offered v dayly perſone lorde leſus chriſt let v fall face good god acknowledgement ſins praying touch v quicke ſuch repentance may perceiue euill v ſeeke remedie therof ſticking rightuouſneſſe conuert v ſuch wiſe himſelf ſtead feeding ourſelues vice lewde luſtes may ſeeke frame ſelues wholly holie lawe commaundements knowing neede haue healed ſpirituall diſeaſes may ſeeke medicine wher foūd wit lord ieſus chriſt renued holie ſpirit may hold way right foorth place calleth v vnto euen till haue fully clothed v owne rightuouſneſſe wee haue continued waye ſaluation ſheweth v nowe worde may pleaſe c xciij sermon third vpon xxiiij chapter 19 earth drieth vp heate drinketh vp ſnovve vvaters ſo ſinners graue 20 louing man ſhall forget vvormes ſhall take ſvveeteneſſe hee ſhall remembred vvicked ſhall broken tree 21 miſintreateth barrein vvomen beareth child doth good widow 22 dravveth ſtrong vnto ſo diſtruſteth ovvne life 23 men giue aſſurance reſt eye vvatch vvayes 24 vvhen bee exalted little caughtavvay die bee made poore bee barred vp like tovvers cut top eares corne 25 vvho hee vvill make meea lyer hee bee ſo vvho hee vvill diſproue vvordes may fare better doctrine muſt call mynd hath bin declared heretofore cauſe theſe thing repeated vnto v wee ſhould bee greeued troubled much wee ſee thing diuerſely diſordred world wee would haue perfecte ſtate heere hope therefore behoueth v beare paciently diſorders whereby pleaſeth god exerciſe v humble v therwithall ſeeke true remedie ſith thing ſo troubled among men ſuche ought put hand amendment forſlow dutie let v learne reſort vnto god truſt let v doubt end wil pitie v although bee fayne ſuffer many wrong reproches time like iob ſhewed heeretofore outrage extortion done ſo alſo ſay god ſeene puniſhe thoſe ſo tormented poore hee addeth ſimilitude may bee vnderſtand two wayes reaſon ſentence verie ſhort broken ſimilitude earth ſoketh heate drinketh vp water ſnowe graue ſinneth ſo ſtandeth worde worde men take though ſayde graue ſwalloweth vp wicked men drie earth drinketh vp ſnowe water ſnowe melteth awaye heate sunne hereby iob ment ſay god puniſheth men apparantly according deſertes die men ſuch execution done vpon perſons whereby men may perceyue god iuſtice rather go common trace god permitteth thē die natural deth therefore ſee god puniſh wicked thoſe haue done ſo many miſchiefes cruelty ſeemeth aſleepe heauen weake ignorant offended though hee regard world though hee diſpozed gouerne v mainteine good ſuppreſſe thoſe ſo vnruly haue ſhewed alreadie iobs intent ſhewe v ſuche caſes behoueth v reuerence god ſecrete iudgementes aſſuring ſelues althoughe wee conceiue reaſon workes yet muſt therefore blaſpheme ſwallowed vp ſorrowe quietly wayte till god ſhew himſelf cōuenient time v ſet day behoueth v tary leiſure aſſuring ourſelues executeth iudgements poynts life intent wee ſhould learne reach fayth hope world ſenſe agree verie well alſo ſimilitude applyed ende thus like earth ſoketh heate drinketh vp ſnowe water ſo wicked men ſinne euen graue iob ſayde bee ſo nuzzled euill whole nature giuen according alſo commonly ſayde menne throughly nuzzled eyther good euil cuſtom haue taken vp maketh become natural vnto beareth ſuch ſway followe without paine iob ment declare heere ſuch hee ſpeaketh ſinne ſtart fittes ſeene ſome man ouerſhooteth himſelf reaſon ſome ſodeine occaſion prouoketh although haue liued honeſtly time without blame yet hee caried time tempeſt thus ſee thē ſome men commit ſome euill outrage continue iob declareth ſpeakes ſuch haue done amiſſe ſodeine pang brayd ouercome ſome forcible temptation ſuch hardened naughtineſſe haue made piece nature therfore like nature sunne melt ſnowe afterwarde drie earth ſucketh euen ſo wicked continue euill euen graue ſay vnto death sith ſee ſuch example yea warned ſentence thinke vpon thing tootoo ordinarie world let v learne reſort vnto god pray giue v grace bowe vnder hande bee ſo giuen ſerue honour ſame may bee naturall v true good ſhall alwayes haue ſome ſtriuing themſelues neuer walke ſo vprightly ſome incomberance gainſtriuing according continuall battayle betweene mynd fleſh neuertheleſſe vertue god hath put v muſt fo farre forth preuayle make v loue good free hart cleaue throughly therevnto muſt pray vnto god ſtrengthen v therein otherſide muſt beſeech alſo ſuffer diuell get ſuch poſſeſsion v trayne v hither thither harden v ſo ſore euill dooing might become nature furthermore ſee men ſo ſtubborne wickedneſſe let v thinke ſtraunge hath euer bene ſo ſee example end iob ſayth quiet man forget ſuch folke wormes ſhall take ſweetneſse ſhall bee remembred heereby ſheweth well wicked ſhall reigne euer muſt haue ende neuertheleſſe god letteth alone peace vntill death ſtate ſeemeth worſe men haue liued equitie vprightneſſe without wrong neighbour man cōpare theſe pollers theeues haue eaten vp men goodes delt merueylous cruelly ſay man compare ſuch haue liued ſimplicitie ſhall finde ſtates alike thing ſo ſhuffled togither cannot ſayde order world yea truly looke witte wee conſider god reſerueth puniſhing wicked till life come intent ſhould neſtle bylowe alwaies haue eye comming lord ieſus chriſt muſte redreſſe thing nowe order nowe wee behold ſhortneſſe life ſee ſuch giuen ſpoyling poore folke go graue become wormes meat ſayd let v vnderſtand verie miſerable wee labour immortalitie promiſed v heere iob ſetteth v downe liuely picture image man life death end might know wee wee haue better hope ſeene eye purpoſe haue liued holily haue endeuered ſerue god pleaſe haue liued among neighbour without deceiuing hurting man yet notwithſtanding muſt gathered graue wicked muſt bee ſhuffled togither muſt wee rot lo menne bee conſidered owne kynde wretchedneſſe wee better hope conſidering alteration world let v warned prouoked lift vp heades looke heauenly life promiſed v although wretched carions ſubiecte rottenneſſe yet let v liue hope lord ſend v partie whome hath redeemed v wil ſuffer deare ineſtimable price hath giuen ſaluation periſh diſappointed lo wherein ought reioyce alſo wherin glorie conſiſteth iob proceedeth declare wicked fully bent giuen ouer vnto euill without awe feare god yea without ſhame worldward ſetteth one kinde namely beguile oppreſſe barreine woman haue borne child good widowes doubtleſſe vnder one kinde iob ment comprehende poore folke able reuenge themſelues haue maintenance ayde man hand ſaying wicked fall hande ſuche kinde folke bycauſe ſeeme fit pray readie prepared ſpeaketh expreſly barreine woman woman haue child although ſhe widowe yet hir chiidren dutie ſhee hath ſome ſuccour ſhe hath ſay ſtaffe hir olde age leane vnto woman husbandleſſe chyldleſſe ſhe vtterly ſuccourleſſe theſe therefore prayes wicked men hunt bycauſe thinke bodie withſtande may doe liſt without regarde god nameth himſelfe defender widowes likewiſe deale fatherleſſe child ſtraungers hath bin ſayd heretofore iob contenteth himſelf giuing one example hee ſhould ſay ſuche men vphild feare god thinke themſelues haue libertie doe euill ſee man let therefore haue raked men good none hath withſtood beſtirre themſelues ſo much take leaue doe liſt vvhy ſo haue regard god ſecondly addeth drawe ſtrong ſay haue long time exerciſed ſayde trade eating vp miſintreating poore ſuche haue meanes defend themſelues gather greater boldneſſe afterward ſet vpon rich alſo whereby make themſelues ſo feared doubted men men fain raunſome ſelues oute handes among outlawes ſo muche euery man afrayde life yea fain compound yet ſpeed neuer better whē haue done become traitor vnfaithfull become alſo like wilde beaſtes haue deuoured fleeced poore ſo men may ſee humanitie yet muſt men faine giue ſome raūſome neuer ſuretie haue done lie wayte life ſuche haue giuen thinke man hath preſented bribe ought receiue euer rent nowe ſee effect howe iobs meening wicked haue miſintreated poore cannot helpe themſelues haue reſcue man hand therevpon become hardie play wood beaſts ſo ſpare man ſet vpon rich ſtrong vpon ſuch credite authoritie wherby extorcion groweth ſo extreeme nothing robbing beaſtly outrage ſo ſhort ther neither mā hood ſhame left tolde v ende ſhould bee troubled wee ſee ſuch example hath bene ſaid afore rather forefenced againſt ſuch ſtumbling blockes might vnderſtand lorde ſuffereth thing ſo intangled end ſhould go inheritance wherevnto calleth v neſtle ſelues though ſure reſting place heere rather learne pilgrymes wayfarer worlde much ſettling v life according saint paule ſayth eſtate chriſtians remoued fro may haue skill profit ſelues theſe thing except god pluck v world maine force wee neuer giue ourſelues ſeeke heauenly life cauſe hee ſuffereth ſo many alteration remouings thing fro ſo thing goe confuzion ſo great diſorder wee bee amazed haires head ſtande vpright muſt ſerue drawe v worlde intent wee bee much wedded thus ye ſee wherevnto ought apply theſe thing againe whereas haue defence indure many wrong let ſure god leaueth deſtitute worldly help end ſhould looke vnto wee muſt impute miſfortune man ſuccoreth v oure neede let v aſſure ſelues god hath bereft v man helpe intent wee ſhould humbled ſelues looke vp vnto ſeeke flee onely vnto refuge lo howe haue practize doctrin furthermore let v vnderſtand therewithall lorde myndeth exerciſe oure charitie wicked ſort worke wrong outrage ſuche haue ſuccour among men ſay end euerie v ſhould endeuer himſelf help ſuche folke according abilitie beholde thing wherein god tryeth whether wee feare trying whether wee haue charitie v wee ſee owne freendes kinſfolke neceſsitie trouble verie nature moueth v helpe wee ſee poore man abuſed hath man beare vp wee indeuer ayde ſuccoure neede ſame ſhall vndoubtedly bee inrolled god token one droppe chriſtianitie v haue declared alreadie lorde recommendeth vnto v ſuche deſtitute man helpe ſuffereth bee afflicted openly oure eye intent wee ſhould ſtreine ourſelues ſuccour bee v bicauſe bee excuſe v ſo oppreſſed wee muſt thinke ſame commeth miſchaunce rather god ſendeth v therefore whenſoeuer god maketh v witneſſes wrong done poore man ſtep helpe ſhielde much v lieth ſurely god noteth marketh watcheth behalfe bicauſe haue ſayde mindeth take tryall louingneſſe nowe let v come ſecond point declared heere iob ſayd wicked ſpeaketh draw ſtrong one 〈…〉 rage water roteth vp tree beareth downe 〈…〉 ſuche haue long time bene hardned euill dooing like great ſtormes tempeſtes rend vp thing yea euen tree houſes appeareth eye would god got ſo much experience ſuch ſharp ſet would faine catching dare firſt daſh ſet vpon ſtronger ſort vpon ſuch haue talon pawes reuenge themſelues withall begin little one giue ſcope euil haue ſtrongeſt howbeit hapneth without wonderfull ordinance god iuſt wage rich men ſuch authoritie credite ſo vexed wicked vvherefore man ruſh leudneſſe ſo ſtriketh one ſtrippeth another commit outrage well eaſe haue mainteine themſelues laugh true miſlike ſuch men miſliking ſeke meanes redreſſe bycauſe matter ſeemeth touche themſelues ſay hee playd ſo wold make feele haue teeth lo howe talke haue credite wealth ſo well fenced touched themſelues meane poore extremely miſuſed vvhētheſe roiſters ſuffred liſt ſee ſcape vnpuniſhed fall buckling great cobbes giueth leaue suppoſe god doeth order eueriwhit manhoode v would pitie rue hart ſee poore folke ſo troden vnder foote make v reſiſt vttermoſt power nothing vvhen poore man outrageouſly moleſted make none account repreſsing miſcheefe rather let looce giuing wicked occaſion ſuch misbehauiour muſt god therefore touch v within ſuffer appoint miſchiefe returne vpon owne head lo heere ſentence well worthy bee noted therein myrrour holie ghoſte ſheweth v wickedneſſe increaſeth groweth full heigth men giue ſcope indeuer redreſſe conuenient time leſſon directed ſpecially rich men ſuch authoritie true ſee ſuch example ſeene courtes great prince three foure minion great credit make whole realme quake ſo much euen haue twentie thirtie thouſand pound rent muſt faine paſſe pawes couche like lyamhoundes giue good piece ſubſtāce purchaſe fauour raunſome themſelues withall vve ſee ſuch example heere howbeit quantitie quantitie man may throughout al place ſee declared good reaſon god prouidence ſhould extend world vpon great ſmall apparant ſuch haue libertie pill poll many annoyance little one muſt alſo ende make great one afrayd touching thoſe haue meane abilitie ayde mainteine poore men god meaneth vnderſtand ſet themſelues againſt thoſe wrong iniurie thēſelues alſo muſt looke pinched ſay themſelues ſhall length anſwere owne perſons men ſhall fleece pick eye worthie ſo ſhall god glorified ſending ſuch puniſhment vpon true diſorder increaſeth dayly neuertheleſſe faithfull maye therein beholde god ſecrete iudgementes yea euen beyond reach man reaſon bicauſe god inlightneth word ye ſee howe ought acknowledge ſelues cauſe diſorder worlde vvee skill complaine thing go petite crie ala wo yea bee readie blame god himſelfe meane wee conſider fault procedeth ourſelues ourſelues ought beare blame ſuch euill euery man would put hande ſuppreſsing vice miſdealings euerie man labor ſtop euil surely god woulde bliſſe ſuche meenings wee ſhould haue delightfull order among v cauſe reioyce ſteade ſeeking remedie thing amiſſe men bring wood kindling fire rather become firebronds themſelues behold maner dealing ought thinke ſtraunge thing bee ſo intermedled neyther brinke brimme al ſhuffled togither like hotchpotch haue ſayd fire kindled wee neuer leaue throwing woode vvherefore lette riche ſuche authoritie haue regarde poore ſee outrage wrong done poore oppreſſed let reach hand indeuer ſuccour perteine rich men ſuch able help poore much perteineth thoſe haue ſword iuſtice hand theſe negligent bee well worthy euill winked ſhould light vpon owne head god ſhould ſet vpon ſcaffolde men beholde iuſt vengeance perſons therefore ſo much ought marke ſayde thus yee ſee ende ought referre doctrine conteyned verſe therewithall ought marke well wordes iob vſeth without cauſe ſayeth men ſhall bee faine buie raunſome themſelues hand wicked haue ſcope ſhal haue giuen ſuch boldneſſe alreadie eate vppe ſome pill poll ſome crouching greazing hand ſhall boote nothing mad dogges nothing content therefore euer man doth ſharpening appetite ſuch bribe doe harten harden take due rente man hath gyuen one preſent would haue hold ſtill neuer leaue ſuche vnſatiableneſſe followeth poore folke distrust owne life yea ſay euen thoſe rich credit muſt faine tremble ſee ſhall ſay theſe wicked men haue worlde bee long ere ſeeth ſuch broath wote howe ſhall bee able ſhift therefore muſt bee faine fawne vpon afore hande muſt gayne ſomwhat leaſtwiſe muſt prouoke diſpleaſure see erewhile danger faine quake diſtruſt owne life giuing bridle wicked ſo wote bee till haue pacified wicked yet fynde meanes howe therefore muſt fayne liue continuall perplexitie anguiſh heerein haue fayre looking glaſſe ſhewe v remedie euill doings due time place ſuffer ſhrewde weedes growe ſo long till get vpper hand man plucke vp would bycauſe tooke due ſeaſon vvee ſee inconuenience inſueth yea euen god maketh heart thoſe faynt might eaſily haue remedied miſcheefe firſt ſo much fare armes brokē haue neither courage ſtoutneſſe become weak water ſayd iuſt puniſhment negligence vſed forſlowing duetie repreſſe miſcheef firſt riſing men ſee poore folke harried miſuſed crueltie outrage yet redreſſe miſcheef muſt needes growe ſo ſtrong ſuch nowe faine would heretofore alſo could haue diſfeated afterward preuaile bycauſe lorde graunteth honour grace let v bethinke v ſay let v bethinke v well let v conſider wretchedneſſe men reſt themſelues vpon god haue regarde diſcharge care vnto whereby might leane vnto protection thing iob deſcribeth v namely men put truſt god ordinarie matter world ſee wicked haue full ſcope muſt deuiſe creepe fauor meane conſider feeding cuill wit make much bolder would bee one mad man deſired nothing kill men one ſhould put ſworde hande another bring ſtore ſtones ſome▪ giue poyſon folkes beſide much doe fawne vpon wicked men ſee credite one commes preſents bribe ſet iuſtice ſale another commes wind himſelfe acquaintance ſome fine deuice inflaming ſharpening rage make egerer whereas ſome miſdoubt hild backe conclude al liſt lawfull neede afrayd bicauſe worlde ſtandes awe ſay ſuch man come lure length reſidue ſhall faine come vnder myne arme make play apiſh tricke see howe wicked become bolder men come fawne vpon faſhion yet worldwarde men deale alwayes ſorte wee haue reſpecte vnto god wee muſt needes bee euermore feare perplexitie ſay neede beware ſuche man ſee muſte bee fayne paſſe handes howe ſhall doe come reaſon plaine proofes vaine hath eares full alreadie therefore muſt goe another waye worke fill wooluiſhe throte ſome preſent muſte carie hym ſomewhat elſe ſee full vaineglorie deſirous aduaunced howe ſo euer bee ſo ſtandeth vpon reputation gazeth owne peacockes feather winne gole skill couche lowe like spaniell ſee none remedie muſte goe waye woorke see ſay ordinarie manner bee doone contrarie parte vvhen wee ſee wicked ſo full couetouſneſſe vaineglorie ſo lyke wilde beaſtes deſtroying thinges let v ſaye vntoo god yet doeſt thou lorde holde reynes mennes brydle thou canſt reſtreyne god woorke ſo ſoone wee woulde haue hym lette v vnderſtande mynde buffet v tyme yet let v aſſure oure ſelues hee watcheth oure welfare ſuffer v vtterly caſt vp pleaſure ſuch ouerſhoote themſelues ſort oure lorde hathe v hande hee neere hande v althoughe wee perceyue immediately yet doeth hee garde v maynteyne v warrant wee may boldely deſpyze wicked ſtoutneſſe ſo muche wee knowe god watcheth oure welfare preſerue v handes pawes aud throtes lo whervnto behoueth v come reſpecte men knowe none ſhift yeeld ourſelues euill confent vnto behoueth v behold protection god hidden v reſpect perceyuing wee haue ſo good certaine recorde holie ſcripture wee ought doubt howe ſo euer world goe let v keepe ſelues purchaſing ſo vnawfull meanes ſo bewray owne diſtruſt vnbeleefe beſides wee bee guiltie alſo euill ſo farre forth v bycauſe weefeede therefore man falles flattering wicked helpeth ſet luſtineſſe redeemeth himſelfe handes raunſome doeth hee fyrſt ſayde hee bewrayeth hath truſt god wee could reſt vpon god promiſes ſurely wee would neuer ſeeke crooked wayes wee woulde alwayes bethinke v whether god permitted thing hath forbidden would ſay muſt wade ſo certaine ſuche labour winne wicked men fauour briberie ſuche like dealing verie infidel bewray themſelues well ynough ſo muſt end payd home honoring god ought allying themſelues wicked nouriſhing naughtineſſe one conſpired breake ouerthrowe order ſurely haue done muche lay doe therefore haue ſaide alreadie let v learne looke vnto god truſt ſhall bee ſubiecte wretchedneſſe whereof iob maketh mention knowe life ſuch defende wicked faſhion reſt vpon god prouidence muſt alwayes tremble neuer bee ſure ſafetie reſt yea behooueth v marke well howe iob addeth wee bee deſirous purchace wicked men fauour preſentes inconuenient meane lie ſo much wayte v ſeene faithleſſe folke ſith feare god pray bee faythfull vnto men nay rather howe poſsible god ſhould ſuffer vſe treaſon miſcheuouſneſſe ſeeing man hee warned hand man caſt himſelf ſo net wilfully excuſe apparant eye men ſee wicked make conſpiracies togither yet notwithſtanding none truſteth howe poſsible two wicked men enter intoo league man would thinke bee ioyned togither like two finger one hande ſo looke one willeth ſame willeth proof eche truſteth certain eyther thē could finde heart hanged ſo himſelfe harme leaſtwiſe could find hearte hee hundred foote within ground end thoſe fauoured become enemy vvee ſee heereby god gouerneth euen midſt diſorder abaſhed confuzion mangling thing let v lifte vp eye aloft ſhall ſee god gouerneth thing ſurely ſuffereth wicked truſt one another inforceth ſtand alwayes feare yea euen vphilde naughtineſſe ſoothing ful hypocriſie intent faune vpon pleaſe ſay euen alſo ſhall alwayes quake feare contrariwiſe put truſt god ſurely although ſuffer many extortion wicked men handes lord permit vexe trouble v yet ſhall wee bee put expedient v indure god haue conſideration bring al thing happie profitable ende ſay remedie wherevnto wee muſt bee prouoked reſorte wee ſee thing order worlde nowe iob hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth bee lifted vp little afterwardes fall downe cut top eare corne bee ſhet vp others ſheweth breefly hee ſayde alreadie looke preſent life wee ſhall ſee orderleſſe maſſe ſo wee ſhall diſcerne one thing another wicked haue large ſcope time yee ſhall ſee vpon top wheele ſay come tumbling downe good men may alſo bee well aduanced yet end faile footing vvhat ſee experience according iob cō cludeth ſaying ſo make lyer thē conſidering ſuch experience let v learne retyre vnto god looke vpon preſent thing doubtleſſe wee ſhall onely wauering reede ſtrawe emptie chaffe caſt toſſed fro wind ſo ther ſhal ſtedfaſtneſſe v therefore muſt haue diſcretion looke vpon thing diſordered world howbeit ſuch wiſe god prouidence always printed mind true reach vnto owne wit yet muſt loke toward eye faith ſo god word may loking glaſſe holie ſcripture ſerue light loke world although god iudgements hidden v nowe let v therefore ceaſſe ſay lord rightuous humble ſelues vnder alwayes haue ſuche eye promiſes wee fayle call vpon midſt diſtreſſe aſſuring ſelues ſuccour v make v feele goodneſſe ſo wee may reioyce midſt temptation world let v fal face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying blot oute remembrance bring v backe himſelfe ſuch wiſe wee may bee tangled theſe earthly thing cleaue wholly rightuouſneſſe liue world wee may paſſe forwarde ſtraungers till wee come reſt ſhall continue v wee haue paſſed trouble temptation mortall life ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſ • e c xciiij sermon first vpon xxv chapter bildad suite anſvvered ſayde 2 soueraintie terrour vvith maketh peace high place 3 number army vpon vvhome doth light ſhine 4 vvhat rightuouſneſſe ſhall attributed vnto man compared vvith god nothing hovve may cleane borne vvoman 5 behold vvill giue light vnto moone starres cleane ſight 6 hovv much leſſe man vvind vvho rottenneſſe ſon man vvhich vvorme foraſmuch wee ſo greatly giuen ſtande owne conceyto ground follie thinke vpon god maieſtie wee haue verie good profitable counſell oft wee tempted take glorie oure ſelues wee muſt caſt vp eie vpon god conſider throughly power might rightuouſneſſe glorie brauerie ſoone layed water ſteade beyng puffed vp pride ſotted ouerweening onely regarde god ynough quayle v ſuch ſort ſhall aſhamed ſelues ye ſee cauſe holy ghoſt dooth nowe perſon bildad giue v warning god ought right haue cheefe ſoueraintie afrayde thinke vppon conſidering order hath ſet heauen worlde wee ought know ſelues ſo farre hauing thing may bee value ſtarres ſhine bright vnto v darke vntoo seeing cace ſtandeth ſo remayneth men notwithſtanding brauerie bee wormes rottenneſſe would glorifie themſelues aboue starres vvere follie ouergreat ſee end wherevnto thing tende conteyned heere forſomuche men cānot humble themſelues ſo long looke downeward god ſet eye maieſtie ende ſhould knowe cauſe ſet ſtore themſelues whoſoeuer exalteth himſelfe god muſt needes bee brought lowe bilded make v perceyue howe greatly ought feare reuerence god alledgeth heere maketh peace high place ſay diſpoſeth order heauen ſuche wiſe men ſee peaſable well ruled gouernment may referred angelles according wee ſay prayer thy wil done earth heauē vvhich doth v wit god yll obeyed heere beneath reaſon rebelliouſneſſe men bicauſe fully fraughted many wicked luſtes cānot ſubmit themſelues rightuouſneſſe ſo deſire angelles wholy conformable god ſeeke nothing pleaſe reſpects ſo may pleaſe reforme v make raigne dominion peaſable beneathe correcting vnruly affection v therefore man might referre ſentence ſaid parcell prayer ſpoken angel howbeit doubt bildad looked wit whole gouernance wee perceyue order heauen although sunne infinite bodie ſight moue ſo ſwiftly might ſeme ſhould confound thing yet could man rule clocke like compaſſe ſay could make kepe courſe ſo iuſt poſsible vve ſee like moone starres although number bee infinit yet diſorder thing well diſpoſed vvherefore without cauſe doth bildad alledge god maketh peace high place onley heauenly creature ſee raigning alſo diſpoſeth whole order worlde ſuche wiſe aboue although thing diſordered moueable▪ many chaunges trouble yet notwithſtanding god fayleth lead al ſuch ende hath ordeined appoynted himſelf true looke downwarde wee cannot ſee gouernment ſo peaſable ſet forth loke vp god prouidence certain euen middes al turmoyles alteration world ſhal perceyue god gouerneth al ſeemeth good himſelfe ſee imported ſaying▪ god maketh peace high place ſay hee brideleth creature ſuch wiſe al chaungings men ſee yet fayleth gouerne ſtill thing fall haue according guydeth ordinance seeing cace ſtandeth ſo let v conclude good reaſon power ſoueraintie feare ſhould yelded vnto ſay ſhould honour feare worſhip partie hath dominion ouer v reuerence acknowledge mayſter ſouerain lord heauen earth firſt bluſh talk might ſeeme ſuperfluous haue well conſidered hath bene touched ſhal wel ſee without cauſe bildad reporteth heere gouernment dominion god hath ouer world▪ ſaying runneth roundly mouth talke god wel ynough mean cōceyue maieſtie make ydoll true acknowne it▪ would euen abhorrre yet yelde god power due whiche ought conceyue talke maieſtie name run roundly mouth way cōtempte▪ oftentimes wee talke way ſcorne mockage bee ſeene men meaſure heatheniſh wheras al knee ought bow al creature tremble mention made name god ſo bolde yeeld reuerence lowlineſſe ſhort men acknowledge maieſtie god neither conceiue power humble ſubmit themſelues vnto ought doo▪ therfore whē ſpeaking god neede qualified vnto v ſay vttered ſuch wiſe may conceyne cauſe holy scripture doth ſo oftentimes adde tytles contented ſingle name termeth almightie alwiſe alrightuous immortall himſelfe maker thing gouetno • thing purpoſe ſayde waken men ouerſluggiſh honour god worthie ſhort loke often ſcripture giueth god name honor vpbrayding v vnthankfulneſſe dulneſſe wee yelde due much rob power glory leaſtwiſe take • honor humble ourſelues exalt magnify deſerueth therefore ſayd god maketh peace high place gouerneth world ſuch wiſe mē ſee thinges muſt ſtoupe vnto notwithſtanding rebelliouſneſſe ſtubbornneſſe men yet ceaſſeth performe execution ordinance let v learne ſit lōger aſleepe dally god haue bene wont tremble maieſtie aboue thing let v remember concluſion made heere namely hee hathe ſoueraine dominion awe ouer v ſay muſt ſubiect alſo tremble al feare ſo ſtande awe ſo foolehardie rather mad ſtriue agaynſt diſpute againſt doings murmure though fault foūd work thus ye ſee men mouthes ſtopped ende bereft fooliſh preſumption may learn tremble preſence god knowe whome muſt yeld obedience cauſe bildad addeth number army vpon doth light ſhine vvhen ſayde army without number ſhewe men woorſe mad matche themſelues ſort againſte god bid battell true doo expreſly yet impoſsible murmure againſt god repine iudgements bee diſpleaſed thing hee dothe wee muſt make warre againſt wherein conſiſteth ſouerayntie dominion hathe ouer v acknowledging power alſo infinite goodneſſe wiſedom righteouſneſſe mercie iuſtice vvhen haue glorify vvell men thinke god doings vnreaſonable blame cruelty chafe agaynſt impaciencie bee offended thing dothe doubt go bereeue diuine glory cannot done without making war againſt ſo whenſoeuer wee glorify god infinite righteouſneſſe goodneſſe power wiſedome much wee made ſome defyance riſe vp agaynſte mortall man taketh hand ſaid heere god hoſts without number beholde angel heauen warned defend honoure formed created likewiſe creature fully diſpoſed auenge maieſty ſo aſſayled v wormes rottenneſſe therefore let v marke well purpoſe mention made heere god hoſts army ende ſhould know oft men preſume murmure againſt god blaſpheme iuſtice muſt haue many deadly enimies bee angel heauen number whome wee knowe bee infinite alſo behoueth knowe creature armed runne vpon end hath god created thing glory ſhoulde ſhine foorth men ſubmit themſelues god willingly yeld honoure belongeth vnto ſpoken heere army hoſts ſhall ſerue fray rather glad ſurely ſcripture telleth v god hathe many thouſandes angel redy commaūdements intendeth elſe make v vnderſtande god hath receiued v fauoure ſtrong ynough kepe v ſafe notwithſtanding bee aſſayled ſides therfore men vtter force they▪ haue practizing deſtroy v yea diuell himſelfe riſeth vp againſt v wee muſt bee afraid vvhy ſo bycauſe god hath heauenly army defēd v according ſaid angel incamp themſelues round v hee hathe appointed angel guide v ſo faythfull perſon ſhal ſtumble vvee ſee infinite number angel ſerueth comfort v end wee might bee ſure god ſuccoure v neede hath wherwith like faythfull leane vnto god ſubmit themſelues al humility preſerued multitude angel euen ſo al ſtriue agaynſt proude ſturdy muſt inforced feare vnderſtande ſet themſelues faſhion againſt god haue many enimies beſide inſomuche power angel ſhall fall vpon ouerwhelme creature ſhall ſerue maynteine glory whoſe power haue therfore let v remember well ſentence ſayde army god without number therevppon let v aſſure ſelues purpoſe men conſpire againſt v ſhall haue aſſembled force togither yet ſhall ſtrong v god ſhal alwayes get vpper hande vvherefore let v deceiue ſelues wee ſee ourſelues well accompanied greate number people gathered v may confounded one moment hand power god againe although alone ynough eyther ſaue v deſtroy v yet moreouer hath army redy furniſhed incomprehenſible maner ſhall ſet vpon v whenſoeuer thinketh good therfore let v ſtande feare let v learne ſayd bee proude wee ſee world hold ſide great power mainteyne v geere ſhall ſtand v ſted conſidering great power god declared heere hereby man maye ſee howe ſore vnbeleefe men blinded put choyce whether wee haue angel heauen watch v gard v ſeruants welfare whether haue againſt v deadly enimies behold god vſeth ſuche goodneſſe grace towardes v appointeth angel v ſeruice ſcripture auoucheth haue v garded therewithal affirmeth thē power ſhould ſay ſtretcheth hande ouer v ende hee might maynteine v whome long wee bee guyded angel garde v al harme euen long ourſelues cannot take benefite offered v vve neded receiue vve ſo farre frō receiuing good turne god offereth v derogation maieſtie fall prouoking angel arme themſelues oure ruine confuſion needes muſt bereft right mind bewitched deuill wee leuer haue angel enimies miniſters welfare redy helpe v guide v ſo bee member lord ieſus chriſte yelde obedience vnto head ſo oft ſpeaking god let v learne conceyue dead thing thinke ſuch wiſe glory ſet foorth v heere foraſmuch dul let v beare mind god hath army infinite number angel redy execute hys commandements ouer beſides al creature obey good reaſon ſhould vvhereas conſequently ſaid light god ſhineth vpon al men expounded god doth ſo ſhedde foorth benefytes vpon men may perceiue ſome ſparks goodneſſe wiſedome throughout thinges howbeit ſpecially reſtreyned vnto men point wherin light god appereth according ſaid firſt chapter ſaint iohn god gaue creature beeing firſte beginning alſo quickened mayntayne ſtate euen power woorde touching men togither life hee gaue alſo light ye ſee creature haue life lorde ieſus chriſt euerlaſting word god haue noble exquiſite life haue eyther beaſtes tree frutes earthe vvhy ſo wee haue vnderſtanding reaſon light god ſhyneth vppon men ſeeing bee ſo greatly beholden bound vntoo wee ſo much blame woorthy wee deface light yes ſurely muſt come back saint paule ſaith act went groping like blinde folke yet ſhould god glory bee perceyued vvhy dwelleth v wee neede ſeeke farre haue life mouing power thus yee ſee expoſition ſentence hathe bene taken god hath ſo bound v vnto making v partaker light wee bee toto vnthankfull go deface glory yeld due wherefore man cannot ſo much ſtirre himſelfe feeleth god dwelleth hold life whome wee may thanke making v reaſonable creature rather beaſtes wee value ox aſſes bycauſe hathe pleaſed god preferre v ſaide brightneſſe wherewith god inlightneth v occaſion v exalt glory ſubmit ourſelues vnder hande thus ſee one expoſition men make text cōteyneth good doctrine whē al throughly cōſidered bildads meening ſimply ſhew god hath ſpred light vpon v end gyue v vnderſtanding reaſon ſhew cannot eſchue preſence muſt faine walke wer ſeeth thinges hathe ye would ſay eye vpon v ye ſee god ſpreading light vpon v much ſay cannot hide ſelues preſence according matter hath talked al like ſaieth god hath angel howge hoſts redy ſeruice ſo addeth doo wee wee cannot eſchew god preſence true wee leape like graſſehoppers hope play horſes broken looce yet ende wee muſt bee fayne yelde vnto god brightneſſe doth ſo ſhine vpō v wee cannot eſchue mortall man therfore whenſoeuer tempted ſuch ouerſight imagin may eſchue god hande let v learne conclude thus yea whither ſhall wee goe wee know power ſpred ouer bycauſe ſighte endleſſe wee gone intoo bottome earth yet ſhould ceaſſe ſee v marke doings let v ſo fooliſh lifte vp ſelues againſt god aſſuring ourſelues purpoſe v toſſe turmoyle make many enterpriſes conſpiracies ſhall auayle v hee ſtill beholde v marke v common leſſon holy ſcripture wee beare ill away leaſtwiſe ill put vre proofe whereof wee remembred god beholdeth v marketh euer ſay pray would walke another manner feare warineſſe tuſh wee feare none men bee ſafe ynough wee haue witneſſes heere beneath thus yee ſee cauſe men giue head wicked luſts god ſpirite beareth ſway paſſe conceiue curſed thing purpoſe vppon theyr hart prouided alwayes body accuſe ſet god ſhining vpon eye bare ſhining rememberance ſurely would ynough ſuppreſſe wicked affection ridde fancy wherwith puffed vp truly aſhamed men much ought moue v iudge men men iudge v theyr owne authoritie owne name doe perfourme iudgement god whome alone iudgement perteineth behold god ſeeth v yet yeld reuerence wee paſſe prouoking wrath againſt v howe may borne wee remember well leſſon god ſheadeth light vppon men ſurely good bridle make v walke pureneſſe conſcience amending faultes wee commit outwardly towards men alſo amending euill hypocriſie hidden within v thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke thys ſtreyne bildad hath ſayde ſo hee addeth vvhat righteouſneſſe ſhall attributed man compariſon god word word god borne woman cleere himſelfe authenticall ſummoning v ſhew v ſtarke fooles ſet ſtore ourſelues beare ourſelues hand haue righteouſneſſe vertue thing elſe v worthy prayſe theefe abrode wood ſtāds awe iuſtice▪ thing elſe true alwayes carieth fearefulneſſe according hath bin ſeene heeretofore god ingraueth ſuch feeling men ſinnes hart muſt needes bee owne iudges condemne themſelues yet theeues runne royot ſtil ſo paſſe cut many poore wayfarer throtes meete catche auauntage yet notwithſtanding afterward whē bee laid vp ſee payment hande hardneſſe laid awater rage quite gone made ſo beaſtly euen ſo v ſo long know muſt yeld account afore god ne conceiue infinite power ſouereyntie hath himſelfe ſuche ouerweening v ſticke magnify ourſelues aboue cloud man ſpeake v righteouſneſſe eaſly find ourſelues vice vertues v lo men beſotted ſuch loftineſſe cannot know themſelues till god ſummon draw force knew themſelues would ſelf eſtimation cauſe bildad ſayeth expreſſely mortall mā iuſtify himſelfe god ſaying great weight ſaide goto ſo long men among themſelues may haue good opinion owne vertues▪ euery maye ſay honeſt man yea ſhall come putting themſelues balance eſteeme muche themſelues men ſaying man hath ſuch fault mā hath ſuch vice vvee maruellouſly well skill controll men abaſe meane time wee acknowen owne infirmity wee couer thē much v lieth ther neuer ſo little drop vertue v leaſtwiſe ſeeme bee ſmoke ſhal ſay anon would haue god ſet ſuch ſtore eſtimation v ſhould vncloth himſelfe cloth v ye ſee pryde men ſo long looke among themſelues come god knowe enter examination owne life feare maieſtie ſuffereth v wrap vp ourſelues hipocriſie vntruth forget theſe fooliſh bragg wherwith wee abuſed time ſo according whiche declared heere whenſoeuer bee tempted pride imagine ſelues haue vertue v worthy eſtimation let v learne cite ourſelues god let v tarrie till draw v let euery man duetie towards himſelfe ye ſee howe lord ſheweth v manner proceeding whiche ought holde v man doe time beare himſelfe hand hath wote vaunt himſelf correct follie ſtatelineſſe let onely conſider himſelfe know let v go vnto god man neuer knoweth himſelfe ſo long looketh vpon himſelfe dothe cō pare himſelf neighbour learne know ourſelues lift vp eye highe make account come iudgemēt ſeate knoweth al thing like mortall men content themſelues pety trifle whome wee cannot make cockleſhels go payment deede thing much eſtimation heere nothing worth therefore perceiue theſe thing vaniſh away god learne ſubmit ourſelues vnto god bee ſo puffed vp pride cauſe ſayd howe man namely borne woman iuſtify himſelf reſpect god howebeit foraſmuche nothing harder bring men reaſon rid ſaide vaine ſelftruſt wherwith abuſed bildad addeth ſhine vnto moone ſtars pure god therfore man worme ſonne man rottenneſſe true ſaying may expounded diuers wayes wit god wil ſhine ſo farre moone elſe ſtreine tent ſo farre ſay hee voutſafe come neere ſtarrs pure ſay al creature neuertheleſſe ſee great noblenes muſt bee eſtraunged god great ſpace betwixt ſayde expreſſely bycauſe creature aboue excellenter creature heere beneath ſoeuer bee god ſo farre bothe moone ſtarres endleſſe diſtance betwixt ſhal come neere expoſition fit ynough good ſooth whether man conſter shining ſtreyning tent commeth one end ſhort bildads meening lord liſted call creature ſhould finde brightneſſe moone ſtarres ſhoulde bee darkned neuertheleſſe bee thinges enlighten worlde yet notwithſtanding muſt needes bee vtterly drowned maieſtie god commeth place nowe let men ſtande owne conceyte boaſt themſelues vvhere bee wing carrie v ſo high wee may take moone teeth ſay wee may ſtye aboue ſtarres vvhen wee thinke haue thing ſelues aſſoone wee come god ſwallowed vp brought nothing reaſon incomprehenſible glorie wee ſee caſe men glorifie themſelues needes ſay muſt satan haue bewitched one would flye aboue ſtars able manne woulde caſte himſelfe foure pace downewarde ynough breake ſinewes yea necke ofte wee haue thing boaſt wee make ſuche leapes ynough breake neckes menne yea angel ye woulde ſaye muſte wee needes bee woorſe madde ſayde afore lo bildads meenings furthermore ſome expounde concerning eclipſes moone meanes agree ſenſe ſimple namely nobleſt creature whiche ſeeme haue euen ſome godhead nothing bee compared god muſt bee abaſed god alone continue ſtate ſo behoueth v knowe nother righteouſneſſe power wiſedome onely reſte vanitie yea experience ſheweth sunne darkned starres neyther yes ſurely ſight againe behoueth v marke brightneſſe whiche haue borowed another little ſparkes wherin god ſheweth glorie ſo neyther sunne moone starres glorye aught owne beſides god ſhould ſet himſelfe agaynſte light light reſt muſt nedes darkened sunne take away v light starres praye would god infinite brightneſſe doo nowe haue wee bildads meening euen moone ſayeth ſhall bee brightneſſe neyther ſhall starres pure god preſence hee ſayde true wee ſee light ſhead whole worlde oure eye receyue wee glad yet ſo farre ſame thing god come euen body moone starres skie light ſayth hee ſhall darkned vaniſh away compariſon god glory let v come vnto men vvhat vvhat able doo vvhat power vvhereof boaſte wormes rottenneſſe yet needes iuſtify ſelues remayneth put leſſon vre apply vſe heere ſhewed v wee come god wee bring nothing woorthy prayſe men vttered bee voyde goodneſſe haue ſo muche one drop righteouſneſſe whereby purchaſe ſelues eſtimation muſt bee fayne yeelde ſelues giltie acknowledging nothing elſe wretchedneſſe miſerie nowe men wel acquaynted doctrine wee ſhould nowe adayes haue ſo many iarres braules wee haue papiſtes ſide eſteeme highly man owne free though men ſome power diſpoſe themſelues godwarde true welynough confeſſe bee weake bee able doo thing themſelues without god helpe without direction grace holy ſpirit therewithall attribute certayne preparation men afterward workfellowes god furthering grace working common companion haue laide foundation fall attributing men ſo none talke among magnifying men vertues merites although graunt alwayes wee haue neede god mercie yet blow bladder full winde ſtuffe withall ſaye imbrewe diueliſhe dogtricks beare men hande merit god accepteth bee worthy grace hathe always reſpect vertues lo howe men puffed vp wind diueliſh fancy reigne poperie furthermore ſay wee amiſſe wee haue work ſupererogation ouerplus wherwith make amends vnto god ſinnes although haue offended know hee forgiue v ſinnes yet wee bring ſome recompence ſatisfaction meane make one v thing ſhewed v heere bildad haue ſeene heretofore well knowen thoſe diſputations would laid downe eaſy matter papiſts iudge ſo randon men righteouſneſſe merites ſatiſfactions free looke vnto god falne aſleepe vayne imagination haue conceiued iuſtifying mē owne good deed therefore behoueth v marke well verſe concluſion let v note wee cite owne conſciences god humble v ſuche ſorte bee ſeeking preſume ſhall acknowledge ſelues woormes rottenneſſe nothing v filthineſſe ſtinch vvhat done oft mē ſpeake v meane ſaluation lette v learne conſider ought repoſe truſt whiche god receyuing v owne meere goodneſſe holy ſpirite purge clenze v frō ſpots waſh v bloud oure lorde ieſus chriſt whiche hath ſhed clenze v withall thereby make v ſo pure cleane may able ſtand face nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying whereas hath ſhewed himſelf vnto v heretofore may pleaſe increace knowledge make v ſo profyte day day drawing towards wee may touched ſuche reuerence may deſire nothing ſubiect vnto ſeruice ſpecially ſith hath pleaſed call v ſeruice may determine imploy ourſelues wholly therein preſuming vppon owne vertues vpon thing bee v acknowledging owne meere grace hath chozen v church people receiuing benefyte wee may drawe fountayne whiche hee hath giuen v witte lorde ieſus chriſte acknowledge belongeth giue v full perfection thing ſtill hope may pleaſe c xcv sermon first vpon xxvj chapter 1 iob anſvvered ſaid 2 vvhome haſt thou ſuccoured hath povver haſt thou ſaued arme ſtrength 3 haſt thou giuen counſell vvas deſtitute vviſedome thou ſayſt 4 vvhome telleſt thou theſe vvords vvhoſe ſpirite gone thee 5 dead thing formed vnder vvaters neere place 6 gulfe naked deſtruction hath couering 7 ſtretcheth northern coaſt vppon vvaſt place earthe founded vppon nothing declared beginning booke propertie whiche required good teacher wanting thoſe came comfort iob whiche propertie deuide god word rightly apply right vſe ſuche skilfulneſſe hee weake may bee ſtrengthened ſorowfull may comforted hee colde may bee warmed gone ſtray may bee brought home agayne nowe verely hathe bene ſayd iobs frendes handled doctrine generalitie good holy howebeeit fayled miſapplying ſame perſon iob let v marke well ynough v ſpeake god cō mon vnleſſe euery v cā referre ſayings good vſe better vnderſtoode laying forthe text point poynt iob demaundeth bildad man hath fared better word firſt ſaith whome haſt thou ſuccoured haſt thou ſuccoured feeble haſt thou helped arme ſtrength ſhould ſay good doctrine ought caſt forth ayre bring fit inſtruction partie ſpoken vvhen wee ſee man vtterly ouerthrowen ſo diſmayed hathe neede comfort ſhould rough ſhould ſtorme pray next way caſt deſpayre contrariwiſe ſee mā hardned ſinnes deſpiſer god yea ſuche one holdeth ſcorne good warning wee ſhoulde ſpeake fayre handle gentle woordes better v holde peace ſet god word ſcorningſtocke ſuche man yes neede ſtrike harde man ſhoulde ſmite hammer vpon ſtith ſeeing partie become ſo ſturdy iob ſheweth heere bildads talking god prouidence hath bin purpoſe ſhould ſay marke plight ſeing thou telleſt thy tale meete thou ſhuldſt haue eye might profit therefore thou oughteſt deale diſcreetely caſt foorth thy word aduentures wee vnderſtande better iob meant ſay ſtreine behoueth v marke howe auaylable god word wee skill applie profyte ſayd ought ſtrengthē ſuche weake releue ſuche feeble vtterly caſt downe ſaide vſe well noted apoſtle epiſtle hebrues wher alledgeth text eſay man ought ſtay trembling knee ſtrengthen weake armes prophete eſay appointeth office ſuch haue charge preache god word go wayes ſaith hee holde vp poore weakelings ſtrengthen quaking knee leggs cannot go vve know thoſe god hath appointed teacher church haue nothing worde whiche put mouthe ſurely yet worde hath ſuche power able redreſſe feebleneſſe men ſo much quaked ſuch wiſe could ſtand vppon feete yet lord ſpeaketh v gyueth v ſuch luſtineſſe wee manner made new whereas could ſtirre one toe afore walke abrode whereas armes earſt good broken able put thing thus ye ſee howe ought ſerue turne god word bee ſtrengthened weake take remedie feebleneſſe certaine knowe value god worde vtterly vnprofitable v owne fault hath charge office teach ought haue good reſpect hearer whome hee ſpeaketh hee ſee negligēt cold behoueth quicken vp harte muſt cheere according deedewe ſee many ſo ſore ſhaken diſtruſt themſelues though man ſpeake god prouidence ende might leane vntoo yet ceaſſe ſtarkle ſomuche heare falling leafe ſtart afrayd ſo vnleſſe man ſtrengthen day day hee ſhal neuer able holde vp falling downe ſtaggering therefore hee ordeyned teacher god church ought haue ſuche conſideration skill hearer bee fayntharted ſlow muſt exhort incourage telling god neuer fayleth thoſe end may call vppon haue called vppō inioy help walk boldly furthermore like muſt teache others ought ſhoote ſaid marke ſo alſo behoueth euery man like owne behalfe according apoſtle ſayeth applyeth aforeſaid text euery priuate perſon ſaying frends prophet eſay telleth v al whome god hath chozen preache worde ought giue corage ſtrength ſuch weake make thē go good pace looke yourſelues whē ſeeth himſelf weake colde plucked backe diſtruſt ouerfearfulneſſe frō ſeruing god neighbor let ſtreine himſelfe let gather ſtrēgth let come ſeeke corage word god flatter yourſelues ſins vvhen ye feele ſelues weake doo ſay weake ye know ye ſeeke remedy god word go reade giue eare promiſes cōteyned mark god telleth mainteyne thoſe fainte ſpirit ſtrong ynough recouer thē wayt ſuch ſuccour hand waiting walke ſtil ſame truſt ſee may profit ourſelues iobs vpbraiding bildad talke vttered ayre bin vnprofitable ſoūd ſaith ſtrēgthē weake ſaue preſerue arme good broken ſo let v mark wel haue greatly profited god word nimble weldiſpoſed doe good haue broken armes trembling knee luſty cheerefulneſſe apply ſelues ſeruice god oure neighbor lo may become good ſcholers holy ghoſt ſo long faynt cold cannot goe one ſtep without ſtumbling reeling let v mark haue ſmally profited heauēly ſchole ſame commeth owne faulte certaine god word hath nature propertie ſo ſtrengthen v ſhal feeble except fault ourſelues let ſuch haue charge teaching tend always mark let euery v haue diſcretion conſider owne behalfe reade holy ſcripture come ſermon thē weake haue neede gather ſtrength behoueth bee heedful may receiue remedy god word giueth bee ſhort according diſeaſes euery man knoweth himſelf let learne whatſoeuer god hath ordeined let imbrace promiſes remedy therof iob hath ſayd ſo addeth whome haſt thou giuen counſell ſuch one want wiſdome expreſly ſaid god law ſerueth inſtruct ignorant little one property extended whole ſcripture whiche nothing elſe expoſition law purpoſe therfore whervnto lord wil haue whole word ſerue foraſmuch blind ignorant wretch ſhould bee taught faythfully ſo might ſtray knowe path wee ought take two three men boaſt skilful wiſe ynough gouerne himſelfe true men bee fooliſh ynough preſume ſo farre vpon naturall wit god laugheth ſuch ouerweening ſcorne ſheweth plainly nothing vanity gay brauerie hee ouertaketh wiſe owne wilineſſe ſhewing beguile thēſelues intende walke owne imagination let v aſſure ſelues v great ſmall poore blind buzzard nothing mā ignorance vntil haue profited god ſchole therwithal let v know guide word al perfectiō wiſedome title teaching ignorant giuen vaine lo cauſe iob vpbraided bildad hee giuen counſel deſtitute wiſedome ſhould ſay blemiſhed doctrine want knowing applie wiſely ought haue done vvherefore end ſuch reproch light vpō v let v learne vſe god worde ſuche ſorte may ſerue v good inſtruction receyuing ſuch doctrine wee may ceaſſe bee wretched beaſtes go aſtray alſo let whome god hathe committed office teaching others conſider well whatſoeuer come men muſt gouerned hand mouth god true vntill ſuch time god hath cō uinced ignorāce glory themſelues therfore fayne pull downe ſuch pride according alſo saint paule ſpeaketh ſayth goſpell ought ſerue pull downe loftineſſe aduaunceth ſelfe agaynſt lorde ieſus chriſte according ſaying firſt chapter firſt epiſtle corinthian behoueth v become fooles wee become wiſe god ſchoole truly ſeemeth ſtraunge v ap •• e leſſon wherein wee muſte continue time life ſo miniſters god worde muſt tell men nother diſcretion wiſedome ende may truſte owne ſtrength reaſon bee ſo ſelfeweening ſay knowe welynough ought liue let thē eſteeme themſelues fooles ſay let acknowledge nothing thēſelues vanitie one drop wiſedome v god woulde trouble v let v alone ſtate nowe intendeth pull downe pride owne profite may humbled become little lowly exalt alone ſubmit ourſelues wholly ſhall ſay vve ſee miniſters god woorde neuer edify people except begin poynt ſhewing men bee vtterly deſtitute wiſedome behoueth euery one v receiue ſame admoniſhment ourſelues acknowledging ſelues vtterly deſtitute voyde wiſedome aſſuring ourſelues ſhall find wiſedome god worde vvherefore let v bee afraid wee ſhall bee ſufficiently taught perfection ſuffer god declare vnto v deſire ſame hande redy receiue whatſoeuer ſhall ſay vnto v wee haue wit ſuffer ſelues bee gouerned god mouth wee haue perfection wiſedome wherein fault bee founde holy ghoſt lyed ſaying proper naturall office good doctrine teache men wiſedome reaſon want nowe ende iob rebuketh bildad ſpeaking rouers ſaying thou haſt ſaid hee meeneth bildads word ruled directed deale withall ſaying well worthy noted ſuch flitter ayre ſort theire talke knowe right deuiding god woorde go buſhe turning pot according wee ſee many diſcourſe generality wote howe apply doctrine profitably ought doo purpoſe ſhould ſtād heere whole halfe day togither expoūd vnto one half booke ſoaring ayre intreating many thinges diſorderly without regarde youre profite edifying euery would go home houſe wiſe hee came church defacing god word ſo ſhould ſtande v ſtead vvhat bee doone let v remember well ſayde heere namely muſt referre doings ſome certaine ende wee take matter hande wee muſt ſpeake purpoſe skilfull ſet thing right order ſo may bee confuſion according haue ſaied minde comfort ſuche ſad ſorrowfull find themſelues diſtreſſed cōſcience haue great trouble behoueth v ſeeke meanes cō fort ſetting god mercie know diſeaſe wee may applie fit remedy vnto mind abate pride rebelliouſneſſe men behoueth v ſhew god vengeance make feele ſpite teeth ſporting matter able drowne thing blaſt lightening conſume nothing man exhorte thoſe pacience tormented cannot paciently ſuffer affliction god ſendeth wanhope deſpaire behoueth ſeeke reaſons fit purpoſe ſpeake much order one man came phiſitiō deſired medicine ſome diſeaſe phiſition ſhould go diſcourſe debate art generall termes ſo poore ſicke man ſhould yeeld vp ghoſt meane whereas might eaſily haue bin cured bin helped hand purpoſe hath al talke ſerued man come maſon put ſome building hād maſon fall diſcourſe building caſtels tell rearing building aire diſputing howe may bee brought paſſe meane regard preſent work toy man ſhould come lawier aske counſell vpon ſome cace lawyer ſhould fal diſputing vpō lawes generall applie thing preſent cace purpoſe let v marke deale god word behoueth v ſet ſome certaine marke v wee wander deuide aright know end ſpeake talke rouing gadding fro elſe wee may ſpeake many good woordes none ſhall ſerue purpoſe thing iob ment ſhew rebuking bildads vnaduiſedneſſe hauing diſcretion applie good doctrine right vſe nowe vttereth ſaying weyeth yet ſaith telleſt thou thy tale whoſe ſpirit come thee ſaying thou telleſt tale ſheweth v ought haue regard perſons whome direct doctrine haue declared already ſelfe alone ſurely v ought profite common go vp pulpit teach men withdraw ſelfe away reſt ſelfe muſt ſcholer word proceedeth mouth muſt ſerue mee well elſe ill meane content ſelfe eſtimation haue reſpect make doctrine bring ſerue youre capacitie fondneſſe behoueth v haue skill applie doctrine ſuch god putteth v truſt hee putteth v office bee meſſengers bindeth v people ſo linketh v church behoueth v haue eies alwayes faſtned vpon ſame vvherefore wee ſhould caſt foorth word aire ſhut eye without hauing conſideration thoſe whome ſpeake ſore abuſing god word let v mark well ſuch haue charge teaching muſt conſider doctrine may good profitable whē ſpeake whole congregation may deale forth faithfully good diſcretion ſo may cōmon profite wee haue conſideration wee ſhall make ſuche minglemangle ſuch hotchpotch god word ſhal nother taſt ſauour chiefe point know demaundeth commeth taught meane ſhould demaund according fleſhly luſt ſhould demaunde thing fit may doo good let v come lay forth iob ſetteth downe heere vvhoſe ſpirit commeth thee true ſentence hath bin expounded though bene ſaide ſpirit ſpeakeſt thou god mē interpretation vtterly miſliked ſurely man taketh vpon beare abroade doctrine ſaluation behoueth take good heede vaunt himſelfe naturall wit aſſuring himſelf matter men purchaſe eſtimation ought gouerned ſpirit god haue vertue whereof paule ſpeaketh end may know god hath ſent thing therefore requiſite man marke well proceſſe text iob following touched afore intendeth rather ſhew bildads word well diſpoſed becauſe quicken ſoule whiche principall poynt haue marke god word ſaid afore god worde ſerueth teach ignoraunt ſtrengthen weake bicauſe incourageth ſuch faint colde ſlouthfull weakeneth ſuch aſleepe ſinnes ſpurneth ſuch foreward lag behind raizeth ſuch falne downe yet one thing namely quickeneth ſuche dead iob meant ſhew ſaid whome ſpirite gone thee ſay power thy wordes therefore lette v marke worde god well handled giueth v courage go forewarde ſtrengtheneth feeblenes making v nimble whereas leggs broken making v ſtoute luſty whereas deſtitute valiantneſſe afore yet muſte alſo giue v life good dead verified ſpecially goſpell behold lord ieſus chriſt ſpeaketh fifth saint iohn time come ſaithe hee voice ſonne man ſhall heard liuing alſo dead thoſe dead surely mā exempted whereat beginneth god make doctrine auaylable v euen drawing v ſpiritual death wherin hild till ſuch time god inlightneth v word wee blind till open eares deafe till giue v faith wee haue nother ſoule hart true may well ſeeme haue ſome outward ſhew life vnbeleeuers eate drinke well faithfull againe go buſineſſe yea oftentimes feeme bee greate vertues nothing bycauſe aſmuch bee ſtraungers god death vtter confuſion god muſt fayne drawe v death vnto himſelfe poynt whereat hee muſte begin make worde auaylable v good ſooth let v ſee ſtrēgth men till god haue ſtrengthened woord truſt themſelues ſay leane vnto reede ſhall make breake neck yea one man woulde gore himſelfe vpon pike aſmuch hath ſharp point armed yron man leane vppon ye ſee pricketh ſuch truſt haue oure owne ſtrength muſt needes death therfore let v marke well one drop life v till god draw v death yea euen power word therin wee ſee howe wretched ſtate vnbeleuers true ſo ſotted outrage perceiue owne harmes yet holy ſcripture always ſhewe ſelfe true auouching v bee dead vtterly forlorne nothing curſedneſſe v ſo long wee bee ſtraungers god yet ſee thākleſſe world many found wil ſuffer themſelues bee rayzed quickened god offereth v benefite willeth word preached publiſhed men thus ye ſee life offered v forſake ſay great multitude ſhrinketh away thruſteth away benefite might inioy see ye ſhamefull thankleſneſſe muſt men needes right wit yet notwithſtanding wee ſee fewe whiche ſubmit themſelues goſpell giue care vvee ſee rayle agaynſt mocke ſlaunder lift vp themſelues agaynſt god ſuch rage leſſe gotten hand wild beaſts ſithe wee ſee number ſo ſmall whiche receyue doctrine ſaluation greateſt parte withdrawe themſelues ſome ſayd making none account ſome mocking ſome outrageouſly ſetting themſelues againſt ſo ſhew full well nothing wickedneſſe agaynſt god therby ſeene mightily satan hathe bewitched howſoeuer world go ought marke well ſentence ſayd ſpirit ought paſſe v ſay whereas dead afore aſſoone wee heare worde god ſame muſt giue v ſuch liuelineſſe ſpirit may ſhew itſelfe whiche onely bene ſwound alſo vtterly quenched true worde god cannot doo thing vttered mouth mortall man muſt firſt bee quickened ſelfe may quickē v vvhen ſpeake mee touche folkes hart make doctrine preach enter ſo euery man may bee moued come vntoo god howe lord neede make word auaylable working holy ſpirit quicken enter v may take roote vnto v incorruptible ſeede life ye ſee god muſt fayne worke ſecrete power ere doctrine auaile preached v men true commeth fault euen ſelues god muſte bee fayne boare eares elſe wee neuer heare hee muſt fayne ſoften heart make fleſhly themſelues hard flint full rebellion yet notwithſtanding worde god ought conteine ſaide power propertie mortifying ſoules let v maruell ende hath god ordeyned woorde appoynted bee preached intent bring v himſelfe come neere vnto v ſo alſo dwell v welſpring life nothing v death seeing hee maketh v partaker himſelfe grace worde ſeeing myndeth dwell v yea liue v ende may lyue doo ye ſee ſayde riſing agayne life whereof ſpake afore therefore let v vnderſtand woorde long wee ſtrangers frō god howe goodly ſhewes ſo euer make bee toto wretched nothing curſednes v wretched ſoules dead although appeere ſome liuelineſſe imagination vvhat done euen quickned god gathering v himſelf thing hee doth mean word seeing treaſure ſuch ſo ineſtimable let v ſet much ſtore let v value deſerueth let v vnthankfulneſſe ſtay god making v feele power workfulneſſe offereth vnto v thus yee ſee effect wee haue marke ſaying iobs nowe hee addeth conſequently hee may ſay many thing god prouidence behoueth conſider ende hee referreth wordes wauer ſo ayre better holde peace behooueth men bethinke well ende diſpute god worde party may bee edifyed doctrine iob therefore ſheweth heere bildad came pith matter wandered aloofe woords vvherefore hee ought ſaith iob haue come poynt ſhall bee declared heereafter meane hee ſheweth hee ignorant ſame vertue bildad ſpeaketh hee ſayth god gouerneth thing great power maieſtie ought terrible v wee ought come ſubmit oureſelues reuerence doe ſeruice true doctrine ſelfe profytable may deſpiſe preached generall yet notwithſtanding needefull looke well handling bee applyed particularly aſſuring ſelues purpoſe tell long tale thing belong matter hand men ought come poynt ſay thus thing wherein iob founde fault bildad diſputing god prouidence hee reſpect whereto word might ſerue cauſe iob ſayth nowe ignoraunt god hath created world gouerneth thing holdeth thing hand maieſtie ought honoured theſe thing knowe better vnderſtanding matter let v marke ſome perſons whome behoueth v ſhew god mightie power bring feare maieſtie may ſtande ſuch awe ought vvhy ſo wee ſee many ſauadge folke whiche haue muche ado conceiue god heauen gouerneth thing bee little better brute beaſts verely man ſpeake god make trifle ſay yea marrie god yet neuer wiſt glory nother euer feeling wonderfull power alſo behooueth v ſhewe god ſeruice ſpirituall wee muſt come ſoundly roundly bee cleane purged hypocriſie know god tuſh neuer enquired haue bene letted muche worldly thing yee ſee moſte men heatheniſh ſo ſnarled delight preſent life thinke al vpon god manner men neede haue former matter told lēgth make feele god maieſtie doubt v haue neede euery one according meaſure ſay theſe matter muſt laide forth length ſuch haue neede bee called knowing god may forced tremble vnder maieſtie whome ſcoffed afore one point haue marke alſo men neede brought conſideration meane euen thoſe haue right feare god euen ſay muſt taught put minde god maieſtie ende may always quake vnder meekened becommeth yet haue doo muſt generally reſte heere haue learned haue laide foundation muſte afterwarde build vpon yea ſuche wiſe buylding may skilfully applyed ground worke made already vnder earthe man ſpeake ſuche haue feare god abace humble themſelues vnder god mighty hand hee muſt reſt vpon thoſe generall matter particularly conſider eache man behoofe hee may buyld well vpon foundation layd already iob meant declare heere nowe lette v come word vſeth ſaith dead thing formed vnder water place neere ſaid goto thou haſt talked mee god mightineſſe tolde army without number creature hand confeſſe yea looke yet looke euen intoo bottomleſſe deepes euen nauill earth ſee god bringeth foorth thing quickeneth thing dead vvhence commeth life creature thing hidden deepeſt gulfes demaunded meanes wee bee ſerued ſtate place god hath ſought life hee giueth vnto men much would go fetch bottomleſſe deepes commeth paſſe earth bringeth foorth frutes howe commeth paſſe come whiche beareth ſuche blade afterwarde yeld graine theſe ſecrets god hidden theſe thing iob commeth vp aloft ſayeth know well god hath ſpred heauen yea euen waſte place ſettling much ſome body would hang ayre tapiſtrie impoſsible men therein god meante ſhewe hi▪ wonderfull power true iob dooth ſet downe north co • ſt preciſely yet ſpeaketh whole heauen bycauſe skie turneth vpon pole like wheeles chariot extree runneth midds wheeles turne round extree reaſon hole naues euē ſo sky manifeſtly ſeene ſay wel acquainted courſe firmament doo ſee skie turneth ſo north ſide starre apparant eye extree rūneth naue wheele whiche sky ſeene turne another pole hidden vnder v whiche cannot perceiue called antartik bycauſe skie turneth alſo though one extree put bothe wheeles▪ hath beene ſayde afore vvhen ſpeake courſe heauen meane daily courſe ſunne ſee ſunne hathe peculiar moouing ſelfe vniuerſal mouing whole cope heauen ſayd two ſtarres faſtned thoſe place ſo remoue ſtirre thus ye ſee iob ſayth god hath ſpred heauen vpon northſide ſpeaketh hee ſo bycauſe ſuche miracle ought amaze v true men haue ſome experience whiche cauſeth ſpeake yet doth ſo wel diſpoſed order ſhewe ſuche wiſedome god wee muſt force cōfeſſe ſame ſurmounteth reaſon man ought nothing elſe honour god greatneſſe ſo vttered creation world cauſe ſayth hath founded earth vpon nothing wherevppon doeth earth reſt vppon ayre like wee ſee ayre aboue v ſo likewiſe ſide earth ſo earth doeth hang midd • true philoſophers make muche diſputing earth continueth ſo ſeing bottome world ſay maruell ſinketh conſidering nothing vpholdeth neuertheleſſe able yelde none reaſon ſeene order nature whiche ſo woonderfull thing men forced abaſhed mount aboue themſelues glorifie god acknowledging infinite wiſdome ſee whervnto iobs woords tend namely ſhew hee ſo beaſtly deny god maieſtie acknowledged glorie howebeeit meaning ſay whole cace ſtandeth treating generally applying right vſe according wee ſpeake fully morrow god giue vsleaue nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele wee may come humilitie ſeeke help mere mercie wander fro bee ſo caſt downe ſelues wee may ſeeke altogither bee releeued grace lord ieſus chriſt dayly profit till fully reſtored aſſuring ſelues hath already begonne good v ſo alſo continue ſame correct fault imperfection fleſh euen til haue brought v perfection wherevnto calleth v hee hath rid v cleane letts hinder v drawe v backe comming vnto may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nacions earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage errour darkneſſe c xcvj sermon ſecond vpon xxvj chapter 8 bindeth vvaters vpon cloudes cloud ſinketh vnder 9 holdeth backe face throne ſpreadeth cloud vpon 10 hath ſet bound vvaters vntill lyght darkneſſe conſumed 11 maketh pillers heauen ſhake maketh afrayd threatening 12 hee clyueth sea povver appeaſeth pryde vnderſtanding 13 hath garniſhed heauens ſpirite hande hathe formed ſlipperie ſerpent 14 theſe outleets wayes hovve little heare vvee vvho hee vnderſtand terribleneſſe povver yeſterday began ſhew ſort wee ought profit ourſelues whiche conteyned workes god conſider reuerently yeelde honour deſerueth thinke neuer ſo muche vpon miracle god doeth yet meane whyle honour ſhall wee bee better let v learne oft god work ſet afore v end ſhould know maieſtie yeeld worthy prayſe iob hath tolde v earth founded ſettled vnto day wonderfull meanes vve go vppon dayly yet fewe v thinke vppon hath bene ſpoken might fare better againe ſayde vntoo v god bindeth water cloudes yet cloudes ſinke behold miracle wee ſee dayly oure eye yet man thinketh vpon ſlenderly ſo ſlippeth away ſayd power god honored handes cauſe iob minding proteſt none number paſſed brutiſhly world without knowing maker ſaith know god byndeth vp water cloudes foraſmuch wonted thyng v make greate reokening howbeeit meane whyle god ceaſſeth ſhewe v maruellous power ſo doyng miracle water ſhould hang ſort ayre abyde faſt vve ſee water flow yea ayre ſo fyne thin gyueth place continually water owne nature heauier ayre therefore water ought reaſon fall downe neuertheleſſe wee ſee hilde tubbes according ſayde pſalmes prophet meening expreſſe miracle whiche misknowen men vſeth ſimilitude ſee verſe importeth ſayde god byndeth vp water cloudes yea euen without ſ • nking cloudes thys ſhewe v oft cloud •• gather ayre ſee water īnclozed yet earth drowned commeth paſſe bycauſe god ſtretcheth hys hand thereby let v knowe hee ſ • eweth hymſelfe v would make v perceyue power hath namely infinite power meeneth wake v bycauſe wether fayre cleere wee regarde nother perceyue glory ſheweth ſelfe maner therfore myndeth teach v another new faſhion ſhetting vp water wyſe lodging ayre ſo hang hild bottle tub barrell ſight heereof god vpbraydeth v oure vnthankfulneſſe calleth v home ſhewing v caces hath wonderfull power ſee ſee man aske thing iob ſpeaketh poſsible vvee bee conuinced reaſon thing appeereth euidently god aboue order nature yet al none v touched nother acknowledge compulſion herein therfore ſeene men much darken god glory thruſt vnder foote ſo much oughte warned marke thing tolde v ſee alteration heauen earthe god could well make ayre alwayes cloſe alwayes fayre ſhould neuer clowde hys wyll haue chaunges thinges continued one ſtay would fall aſleepe wee woulde imagine fortune gouerned ſuch varietie bee conſtreyned whither thinke god hād worketh ydle heauen hath created world afterward let alone alſo diſpoſeth al thing guideth creature ſuch ſort wil haue v know neere hand v lo whervpon ought muſe ſee skye troubled cloud thickned ayre rayne alteration ſeaſons namely meane lord ſheweth himſelf v draweth v vnto bycauſe wee conſider ynough ſelues thus ye ſee haue mark ſtreyne ſayd hee withholdeth face ſight throne putteth clowd pleaſeth hebrew worde iob vſeth ſignifieth ſometimes ſhet vp ſometimes alſo ioyne c • oſe together▪ whē man maketh barres yron building ioyne timber woork ſtones togither ſhetting one within another may holde faſt morter ſayde god maketh ſuch barre foreſyde throne heauen termed ſeate hee incloſed wee knowe hee filleth thing beeing ſo infinite ſpredde earthe well heauen teache v looke vpward whē intend thinke vpon god ſuch infirmitie rudeneſſe inſteade exalting god wee dayly abace thē oft ſpeaking behoueth v lift vp mynds worſhip reuerence muſt thinke vpon earthly thing ſurmiſe aught owne deuyce fanſie loe god throne heauen according ſcripture ſayeth ſaye hee ſhet vp ſhew v highneſſe maieſtie ende wee ſhould ſurmyze owne faſhion owne rude groſſe beetleheaded wit men terme ſhort behoueth v moūt aboue creature wee intende thinke vppon god rightly▪ let v come ſentence ſayde god hathe made barre throne truly wee marke well order heauen thing ought rauiſh wittes philoſophers haue bene inquiſitiue curiouſe ſearching heauen ſhould nature coniectures ſo beſte concluſion wee make acknowledge god hathe made ſuch principall peece woorke behoueth v wonder confeſsing ſelues vnable comprehēd ſo hygh ſo profounde ſo ſecrete thing ſo without caſe iob intending magnifie maieſtie god ſpeaketh heere ſayde barre whiche hath made foreſide throne afterwarde addeth agayne god ſpreadeth cloude vppon listeth vvhen wee ſee ſayd alteration end ſhould knowe god hath ſtabliſhed order thing hee created world ment ydle euer dayly guydeth gouerneth thing hathe created holding hand continually bothe vppon heauen earth vppon thing elſe ſhewing himſelfe father making v feele thē let v ſo blinde loking vpon skyes perceyue liuely image god maieſtie wonderfull power ſheweth there▪ better v eye picked haue fruition ſight theſe goodly work god except proceede turne behoofe mounting vp authour brute beaſtes ſhall beare blame hauing lyght bycauſe haue reaſon know workemayſter parte certayne ſhall neede none thing condemne v god take excuſe v beſides eye hee hath alſo giuen v ſome reaſon vnderſtanding comprehende woonderfull thing ſheweth v bothe aboue beneathe ye ſee whereof haue neede warned ſame purpoſe ho 〈…〉 ghoſt ſetteth v varietie heauen wherof wil ſpeake yet hereafter ſhort chiefe poynt life beyng partaker thing god hath created vſe ſhoulde learne magnifie hath giuen v ſuch grace poſſeſſe creature without dooing homage thē lo effecte ſhewed v heere iob addeth immediatly hath ſet boundes water euen vntill light darkneſſe come end beholde yet another woorke god well worthie bee remembred namely water bylowe bounded god
