holdeth faſt ſo cānot paſſe bound ſame indureth ſhall continually indure vntoo worldes end ſpoken aſore water aboue water god draweth vp cloudes hild ayre til make poure downe rayne certayne god bound ſea water earth ſhould couered man aske philoſophers ſuch ſerche whole order nature confeſſe elementes theire full ſcope throughout according vntoo theire nature earthe ſhoulde bee hidden vnder water good ſooth experience ſhewes ſo earth middle world bycauſe firme ſubſtantiall reaſon weyght water lighter withall ſhedde ſo ſo firme conſequently ayre aboue water fyre alſo aboue ayre vve ſee element diſtinguiſhed according property seeyng ayre inuironeth whole earth wee ſee water alſo ought goe round betweene bothe ſay betweene earthe ayre theire propre place ſituation lyke fyre ouerſpreadeth ſo alſo would water leaue one foote dry ground mountaynes yea euen hygheſt ſhould couered vnder wee ſee lowe hollowe place abyde drie yet sea mounteth aboue ſo man may perceyue reaſon ſhewed wee conſider thing ſea ſpecially riſeth aloft woonder earth ouerwhelmed vve ſee heere notable miracle yea men ſhet eye owne vnthankfulneſſe heathen men reaſon driueth therevnto acknowledge whereas pleaſed god haue ſome place voyde ſame plant mankinde hee reſpect vnto men ordeyned part earth abide drye verye infidelles ſpeake truthe ſo ſtrong inforced confeſſe meane whyle glorifieth god acknowledge good hath done v wee dumb prayſing whiche worſe wee defyle earth hath giuen v dwel vppon hath made water withdraw themſelues hath fettered vp cheynes although giue v roome dwell vpō yet ſaid defile earth filthineſſe ſinnes verely acknoweledgement god receyueth hand man openeth mouth glorifie ſo without cauſe theſe thing tolde v conſidering witts ſo dull think vpon specially muſt marke ſhall ſayd new againe according alſo ſpoken cheefly prophet ieremie ſea ſo violēt thing ſeemeth meanes hold yet barred within liſtes ſea ſeemeth threaten drowne earth ſeemeth earth ſhould ſwallowed vp ruſhing forthe enery waue conſidering wee ſee ſo great violēce ſea ſo terrible thing maketh heares ſtand vp vpon head muſt nedes behold mightie inuincible hand god confeſſe power ſpoken heere manifeſt much ought wee bee touched quicke what▪ god maketh sea remoue ſorte wee haue wit know god infinite goodneſſe towards v like power yelde thankes confeſſe ſelues beholding diuerſe wayes lyfe creating v putting v worlde nurriſhing v ſpecially earthe drouned vnder water ſome dry ground left v dwell vpon beholde ſay purpoſe heere ſpeciall mention made ſea god withholding ſo water ſorte ſhet vp whiche thing cheynes cordes could bring paſſe wilde beaſts worlde might eaſlyer tamed sea yet god ruleth yea ouerruleth wōderfull incomprehenſible maner behoueth v marke ſaying iob addeth heere ſame ſhall continue till light darkneſſe come end bee medled togither v vnderſtand god doeth miracle one day ſhort tyme alwaies ſo ſame hathe ſhall continue euer although often ſurges ruſh forward backward yet notwithſtanding god doeth alwayes reſtreyne sea winning pleaſeth threaten men withall end ſhould lerne humble themſelues walk greater warineſſe thus ye ſee howe iob ment augment commendation power declared god ſayd water bounded bordered till worlde come end till lyght darkneſſe bee mingled togither ſay till order nature ceaſſe imported maner ſpeeche man alledge sea alſo • yuers ſome time get vpper hande ſo paſſe boundes teare vp thing ſo bothe howſes vineiards ouerwhelmed exceeding greate exceſsiue breach made violence sea anſwer therevnto yet notwithſtāding god ceaſſeth preſerue worlde generall ſuffring sea paſſe bound wiſe make v thinke vpon power ſhewed v wee well aduiſed yea little reaſon v certain would daylye honor god life preſerueth v euen graue▪ vppon earth surely euen graue beholde ſea water ouer v whome long ſwallowe v 〈…〉 god holdeth hand betwixt v wee bee ſo farre marking wee become like ſwyne filling belly pampering ſelues god benefites thinking one whitte vppon thing ſheweth v eye witte wee cannot lyue one minute houre myracle brydleth ſea ſuche wiſe god therfore ſtirre v vp knowe power doeth well ſuffer ſea paſſe boundes reporte hereof thinke ought thinke wee bee blockiſhe letteth lyke happeneth whole worlde bycauſe god maynteyneth order nature whiche hathe ſet ſafetye woulde becoome one gulfe lake god hande ruleth aboue lo howe wee ought profit ſelues ſouereyntie whiche god hath ouer ſea water ende wee may knowe fatherly care hee hathe lyfe feeling muche wee bounde vntoo indeuer • oo ſerue honour walke obedience warineſſe furthermore manne reply theſe common thing needeleſſe bee preached nowe bycauſe euen yong child doo knowe ſo muche woorſe neede haue gone ſchoole haue learned deepe cunning knowing thing ſo common ordinary men yet ſhewe effect wee beare remembrance wee ſo muche vnexcuſable thus ſee cauſe lorde telleth v ſuch thing euery man ſeeth deholdeth bycauſe muche ſay wee doo wickedly abuſe ſight hee hathe giuen v foraſmuche wee profite beholding creature magnifie power hee ſheweth therefore although bee greate matter ſeeming knowe ſea water ſo reſtreyned earthe periſheth yet notwithſtanding greate wiſdome conceyue well thereby▪ god therein declareth ſelfe bee father protector giuing v ſuche experience goodneſſe power becommeth v bee aſleepe vvhen wee haue theſe thinges well printed myndes wee haue profyted well onely day twoo alſo tyme lyfe ſcripture ſayeth perfect wiſdome marke well god workes referre right end nowe followeth immediatly pillers hcauen ſhake bee maketh afrayde • voy • e iob hathe ſpoken order dayly ſeene worlde hee addeth immediatly men ſee ſuche mouings thūders tempeſts god maketh heauen ayre ſo ſhake ſeemeth ſhoulde ſinke thing done diuers maner make v perceyue mighty power ſtrength leaſtwiſe wit reaſon conſider surely heuen vpheld pillers ſimilitude iob vſeth heere bycauſe great place huge building cānot ſtay vp themſelues borne vp vpon pillers like man ſhould build great temple nede haue pillers beare vp ſo great weight euē ſo heauens ſeeme bee building requireth haue pillers yet hath none power god ſuffiſeth building whervnto mē cānot attayn good ſooth power haue men build following god hath ſhewed yet ſame ſmall ſpark infinite power wiſdome men cānot make hall hūdreth foot length bredth without pillers behold heauen infinite ſpace cōpariſon yet ſee borne vp power god therfore iob ſpeaketh pillers meening pleaſe god ſend tempeſt thūder ayre roreth ſort foundation pillers heauen ſhaken end might know god high aboue dwelleth gouerne althings ſhet vp ſayd intent thereby might take warning lift vp hart mind think vpon honour reuerence humilitie imagin fleſhly earthly thing vve ſee iobs meening like god one ſide ſheweth v power holding sea cheynes limiting within bound cannot ouerpaſſe ſo part pleaſeth god make thunder rattle moue tempeſt ayre thē ſemeth al ſhould go wrecke nothing ſhoulde bee able ſtand longer thus yee ſee another particular wherin god maketh v perceyue mighty power truely heathen men good skill confeſſe ſame fineneſſe witte common experience ſaying men heare thunder tempeſts muſt maugre hart fayne feele ſome inkling godhead lo heathen men haue ſpoken▪ yea euen deſpizers god filthie beaſtly folk ſeeke nothing mocke religion blearing toung god cā ſayd concerning gouernment order nature euen ſay abaſhed hearing thunderclappes experience ſheweth v vvhy ſo bycauſe lord giueth token excellent power reaſō iob beſides diſcourſe continuall order nature addeth nowe tempeſts thūders lightning ſhew although men deſpize god wilfully ſo hardharted wil perceiue god ſheweth yet god maketh pillers heauē quake ſhoting forth ſuch thunderclappes ſeemeth ſhall go wrecke men inforced conceyue ſome feeling godhead ſome ſoueraine power aboue ouerruleth al thing paſſe aduenture therfore muſt nedes ſome wil wiſdome gouerneth lo purpoſe ſentence alledged v therby warned firſt brutiſh nature pitie nay rather ougly thing whereas bee reaſonable creature yea ſeeme haue ſuch wiſdome ſhould able cōprehend thing thervntoo god giueth v ſo great ſignes maieſtie bothe aboue beneath manifeſting himſelf vnto v beyng alwayes hand v yea vttering himſelf ſo familiar maner vnto v wiſh yet notwithſtanding wee ouerpaſſe ſo thing entereth v although wee warned neuer ſo much see yee greate outrageouſe frowardneſſe let v vnderſtād ſo vntoward nature ſeeking deface god glorie ſame manifeſted vnto v wee ſhet eye agaynſt perceyue vvherefore let v aſſure ſelues oft god lightneth thundreth heauen playne vpbrayding v ſhould ſay yee curſed creature haue planted world haue giuē earth dwell vppon haue furniſhed good thing yet notwithſtanding wheras haue bin liberall towards ſhew ſelf louing mercifull father know haue quenched beneficialneſſe certaine ſpitefulneſſe wilful ſtubbornneſſe owne ſeeking darken light eye seeing caſe ſtandeth ſo muſt fayne come terrible maner ſummon make feele ſpyte teeth ye cannot eſchew imcomprehenſible maieſtie thus yee ſee thing whiche wee haue marke thūderings riſe • yre tempeſt much god ſhould caſt v teeth frowardneſſe vnthankfulneſſe wee take profit common continuall order ſeene heauen earth dede cannot open eye god ſheweth himſelf v thing ye ſee alſo intent theſe thing reherſed vnto v wheras ſcripture hath ſpoken v generall order world ſeene ordinarily men ſetteth downe alſo extraordinarie according heere mention made thunder ſayd clyueth sea mighty power appeaſeth pryde vnderſtanding▪ iob repeteth ſayde afore true another ſpyce god power hee ſayeth hee cliueth sea waues heaue vppe themſelues ſeemeth ſea ſhoulde ruſh vppon v ſwallowe vp man middes hee ſeeth dreadfuller ſight waues ſeeme mountaynes ſpace betwixt gulf yet bottome bee ſeene iob ment ſaying god clyueth ſea afterward appeareth pride ſuddeyne chaunge ſerueth ſhewe god myghtie power better man bee midds sea greate tempeſt ſee ſo houge hygh mountaynes water hee thinketh ſea may bee caulmed onely within ſpace twoo three houres alſo within whole yeare ſeemeth impoſsibilitie ſo greate contrarie chaunge ſhoulde inſue ſo ſhortly yet man ſhall ſee sea hath bene ſo turmoyled becommeth caulme quiet within whyle seing thē thing chaunge ſo ſuddenly cannot men ſee wonderfull power god iob mēt vtter thervpon may gather intent expreſſe cleerly aduaunce highly thing ſayd afore generally ſayde god boūded sea▪ ſayth cliueth mightie power thervpō ſayth god hath garniſhed heauen ſpirit ſhaped ſlipperie serpent vvhen ſpeaketh serpent meneth serpēts earth purpoſe ſhould haue matched heauen hee ſpeaketh number starres whiche commonly called serpent bycauſe thoſe starres ſtand writhen row maner serpent wrytheth taile reaſon wrything figure ſhape hath beene termed name snake ende men might better diſcerne god woorkes aſunder one another true folk haue intermedled fable yea euen wicked fable diuell hathe alwayes knacke turne men aſide creation worlde haue ſingular auouchment god maieſtie neuertheleſſe firſte vſing terme serpent snake teache mē looke better vpō order starres againe whē iob ſayeth god garniſhed heauens spirit vnder one kind hee comprehendeth whole thoſe ornament thoſe beautifyings ſayth starres giue faſhion heauen▪ without waſt thing ſight ſhould confounded foraſmuch haue sunne day starres night therby know better god thought ynough haue made welkin reſpecte neceſſary v haue ayre wherby breath alſo brightneſſe giue giue v light aboue alſo mēt moreouer adde ornament thervnto therfore ſetting starres skye decking ſuch beautie end ſhould prouoked magnify goodneſſe wiſedome mighty power finally ſhould glorifie meanes ſee iobs ſetting god work v witneſſe hee parte liued worlde heatheniſh skornfull ſort doe whiche yelde god reuerence ne acknowledge power might honour ſame printed euery whit hart mynd herewithall alſo bee warned ſhet eye god ſheweth himſelf faſhion vnto v leaſt ſame vnthankfulneſſe caſt teeth namely worſe brute beaſtes inioying god ineſtimable benefites without yelding honour ſeruice concluſion iob ſayeth outleetes wayes yet peece conceyue comprehend dreadfull power loe concluſion worthy wel marked according great weyght therof purpoſe v behold god work except conclude determinatly paſſe vnderſtanding • eathe ſo great high thing muſt neceſsitie dazeled man applyeth whole ſtudy know god heauen earthe would fayne glorifie workes thinke poſsible know ſurely diſhonoreth god god greater diſhonour go incloze mighty power within capacitie witte man would take vpon ſhet vp ſea land owne fiſt hold betwene cupple finger ſurely greater madneſſe heauen earth ſo great thing iuſtice power wiſdome goodneſſe god little mark although men bee neuer ſo diligent ſearching god work yet think themſelues ſo ſharpwitted attayne ſo ſelf wiſe ſay know much bee knowne ſee perfectly good wiſe god beholde ſhamefull wrong offered vvherfore let v marke well chief poynt whiche wee ought beare mind conſidering god work bethink v owne weakneſſe know wit feeble mount ſo high ſo muſt fayne confeſſe dauid wonderfull thy woorkes ô lorde recken vppe vntoo thee true dauid reckeneth well inſtructing others thinke well vpon howbeit hath ſayd hee addeth end lord cā atteyn euen ſo ſayd ſtreyne behold owtleets ſayeth iob theſe ſayth hee ſuburbes enter hart god work ſhall neuer atteyne vvee bee ſlow lumpiſh mount vp ſo high vvee bee ſo lythe retch ourſelues ſo farre wide nother haue ſuch liuelineſſe v wit muſt bee fayne bee▪ ouerwhelmed haue applyed indeuer throughly know god work howe excellent atteyn perfection knowledge let v remember ourſelues haue found owtleets impoſsible v come depth capacitie ſerue v therto vvee bee groſſe weake ſmall peece v inſomuche angel heauen came preached vntoo v yet could ſhew v ſmall part god woorks ſhall mortal creature bylow sith ſo let v lerne magnify god ſuche wiſe nothing may let v yeeld due prayſe although wee ſhould time life imploy whole wit glorifying magnifying yet impoſsible diſcharge ſelues hundreth parte dutie owe vnto nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele har • ie repentance deſire forgiueneſſe wee may beſeeche amend miſdooings ridde v vyces ende whyle wee liue worlde wee may inioy great good doeth v applying ſame right vſe namely ſeruing honoring ſuch wiſe wee may haue eye ſhet ſheweth maieſtie ſo euident faſhion foraſmuch dazeled owne vnderſtanding let v beſeeche inlighten v holie ſpirit waken v • drouzineſſe wherein wee bee wee maye ſeeke thing elſe ſpende ſelues ſeruice incorage others thereto example ſo hee may bee exalted magnified men one common conſent deſerueth performance thereof let v pray rayſe vp true faythfull miniſters woord c xcvij sermon firſt vpon xxvij chapter iob tooke vp parable agayne ſayd 2 god liueth hath taken away right almightie vvho hath ſet ſoule bitternes 3 long breath ſhall continue ſpirit god nozethrills 4 lippes ſhall ſpeake vvickedneſſe toung ſhall vtter deceyte heere haue ſtill ſame matter hathe bene treated heretofore iob vpholdeth afflicted fault committed ſome ſecrete reaſon liſted debate pleade matter could iuſtifie cace agaynſt god agaynſt ſuch woulde beare downe hee wicked man conclude affliction whiche indured bycauſe greatneſſe ſinnes iob vpholdeth cauſe moued god puniſh wickedder men ſome ſecret vnknowne reaſon men therfore behoucth mount higher ordinarie iuſtice god ſhewed law wee ſee ground woorke chapter therfore ſayd iob tooke vp parable newe agayne intent thing whiche ſayeth may authoritie beginneth proteſtation importeth othe god ſayeth liueth hath taken away right euen almighty hathe ſet ſoule anguiſh yet al wil neuer ſwarue whereas haue maynteyned ſelfe bee rightuouſe pryde hypocriſie ſturdineſſe knewe god myght afflict mee ſorte bycauſe ſuche one make mee bee nother euer graunt god puniſhing mee deſertes leaſtwyſe bee compared men pretende falſe wicked thing god handleth men worlde preſent lyfe according woorthineſſe deſeruinges ſo god doeth oftentymes deferre puniſhments intendeth lay vppon men ſo bee perceyued till death contrarie part diuers tymes hee pretendeth ſignes greate rigour agaynſt thoſe whome loueth whiche haue ſerued faythfully therfore muſt make much haſte god iudgements think executed firſte brunt ſhoulde god bee vniuſte vvee ſee thinges diſordered preſent thing wee looked hoped redreſſe hereafter tyme come god woorſe blind haue skill ynough ſay thing go ought doe doeth followe eyther god knoweth doeth elſe muſte hope hee one day iudge worlde hang ſuſpence mind hild doubt reaſon thing ſo confuſed therein god exerciſe v ſhewe v nowe tyme warrefare therefore like battel man knowes hathe wonne loſte ſo long blowes giuen bothe ſides men yet afrayd victorie ſheweth getteth vpper hande euen ſo muſt al thing need confuzed ſuch hurliburlie world inſomuche man iudgement cannot perceyued hoped god wil ſet thing right ſtate agayne verely yet muſt wee wayt neuertheleſſe howbeeit nother day morrowe doeth iob hold opinion whiche ſeemeth ſtraunge whiche god hath taken plucked right hee ſeemeth pleade god defence owne rightuouſneſſe ſecondly accuſe god crueltie outrage thus ſee two thing might bee verye ſtrange iobs intent knowne let v mark ſayeth god hathe bereft right hee meeneth god vſeth tyrannicall maner dealing nother meeneth hee himſelfe ſo rightuouſe god cauſe puniſhe yet rigorouſly rather hath eye ordinanarie rightuouſneſſe written lawe purpoſe ſuch condemned haue ſayd iobs frendes went thus namely god puniſheth ſuche haue doone amiſſe father sauiour good men therefore foloweth iob wicked man deſpizer god life order men ſee puniſhed extremitie ye marke al aduerſities happen commonly worlde bee ſo greate therfore muſt needes concluded god hathe founde man bee outrageous ſinner aboue reſte loe concluſion iobs freendes made delte yet woorſe reſted vppon curſes god lawe imagining muſt accompliſhed preſent life reward good ſeruers god death thought wicked ſhall bee puniſhed elſe heere ouerth wart expounding god lawe although lord threaten puniſh offender meeneth reſtreyne himſelf certain time true ordinarly ſeene preſent lyfe howebeeit continually wee muſte make generall rule without exception bringing god much vnder coram wee ſee iob better end ſtaffe agaynſt freends therfore let v beare mind hath bin tolde afore ſtandeth v hand haue great diſcretion iudging affliction god ſendeth well vpon ſelues vpon neighbour wee ſhould conſter god loue towards v according preſent handling v inough make v deſpaire euery blowe true puniſh v alwayes well worthie howſoeuer world go wee ſhoulde imagine god hateth v bicauſe handleth v roughly ala thing could call vpō could haue comfort aſſuage ſorrow ſo ye ſee ſhould vtterly vndone vvherefore behoueth v bee ſo wiſe knowe god afflicting men alwayes ſinnes bycauſe hee minded exerciſe pacience tame fleſhly luſts bring thē wholy vnder awe teach thē preſēt life muſt iourney worlde told thē reſt heritage deale otherwiſe ynough caſt many v deſpayre ſuffer aduerſitie like lōg iobs freends vtterly ouerwhelmed ſtanding vpon poynt god puniſhed ſome great ſinnes iob hearing ſuch wordes might haue bin caught ſuch feare ſhould haue knowne el haue takē himſelf damned curſed man ſo ye ſee alſo ſhuld vvere pride condemning innocent thing let v remember well ſayd pſalme bliſſed man iudgeth diſcretly aduerſitie ſo ſee god chaſtizements may profit ſelues looking vpon ſuch ſuffer hardneſſe alſo vpon ſelues moreouer let v always meaſure men ſinnes affliction oftentymes good handled roughlyer bad therfore behoueth v examine men liues throughly fall concluding ſay man puniſhed god ſome great ſin know wicked ſee god puniſheth let v ſtande awe knowing god ſetteth v looking glaſſe liuely image ſhewe v ſhall befall v wee haue feare wee returne vntoo man haue liued well wee perceyue puniſhed let v hold ſelues ſhort tary god leyſure till ſhew v iudgement let v ouerhaſtie meane whoſoeuer holdeth himſelfe ſtill certaine may peruert god iudgements euery turne miſiudging conſequently ſhall vſurpe authoritie belongeth god alone ſo let v come againe iob ſayeth god hath bereft iudgement vvhat meening theſe wordes haue ſayd afore iob meeneth god vſeth tyrannicall faſhion ſo marke one poynt againe meeneth hath ſo good right ſide ſhall able get vpper hande cleere himſelfe haue done amiſſe matter ſhall come debating declareth affliction indureth thicke dark clowd bereeueth knowledge vprightneſſe therefore aduerſities puniſhments wherewith god manaceth tranſgreſſers law well vnderſtanding hereof behoueth v call remembrance hath bin declared alreadie threatnings conteyned law god puniſh men perſones goodes houſeholde cattell continuall ſay although god puniſhe diſeaſes warres dearth famin drought ſuch like thing although hee puniſh offender deſpyzers hys worde yet doeth happen ſo alwayes one • ate vvhy oftentymes affliction common good bad doth god threaten ſort ſhewe hath iudgement come nowe giueth ſome ſignes token ſhoulde performe iudgements perfectly heere beneath would become would hope purpoſe ſhould comming lord ieſus chriſt ſerue would become confeſſion fayth ſay beleeue reſurrection fleſh life euerlaſting nowe knowe preſent life tranſitorie corruptible alſo ſubiect many miſeryes haue wee felicitie god promiſeth v hidden v therfore behoueth wicked alſo puniſhed part nowe god giue reſpite reſerue damnation haue deſerued vnto laſt day wherin ieſus chriſt ſhall iudge worlde fully ſhall ſaying eſay bee fulfilled knee ſhall bowe maieſtie god ſame thing doone nowe howbeeit partly ſufficient nowe gyueth v ſome inckling hee iudge worlde let v returne iobs woordes howe doeth god bereeue men right puniſhing ſuch wiſe may ſeeme bee vtterly reiected bending himſelfe agaynſt mortall enimies outwarde appearance cannot bee ſayde men wicked accurſed wee muſt holde maximee generall rule god good ſo muſt needes bee ſayde ſuch enimies euill nowe wee ſee manne afflicted ſuche extremitie may ſeeme god vtterly inflamed agaynſt wrath precyſely bent agaynſt according naturall reaſon wee conceyue none ſuche one enimie god iob therefore meeneth right bereft bycauſe god hath ſet ſoule anguiſhe himſelfe addeth almightie ſayeth hath ſet ſoule anguiſh ſo long wee perceyue cauſe god hath puniſhed ſo ſo long right buryed inſomuche hee may ſeeme worlde bee wicked deteſtable perſone let v marke well hee ſpeaketh heere common opinion meeneth god hath ryghtfull reaſon ſo doo ſpecially hys owne ſecrete purpoſe behoueth v mounte vp higher ſtye aboue thicke darke cloudes darken lighte elſe wee ſhall neuer knowe iobs rightuouſneſſe ſee double rightuouſneſſe god one manifeſt vntoo v bycauſe conteyned lawe alſo hathe ſome agreement reaſon god hath giuen v whiche paſſeth oure vnderſtanding therefore comprehende fayth muſt rather honour thing hidden v wayting comming latter day wherein ſhall ſee thing face face nowe darke hidden v ordinarie rightuouſneſſe god conteyned lawe vouchſafing ſuccour v neede ſhewing hee hath care welfare wee feare ſerue wee walke obedience accounting father doeth alſo ſhewe hee auoweth v bee benefites faythfull receyue god hand worlde walking feare ratifyings ſayde ordinarie rightuouſneſſe conteyned lawe true neuer deſerue god ſhoulde pitie v whatſoeuer wee yea euen wee bee gouerned holy ſpirite certaine woorkes ſtill ſoyled god may good right reiect ſelues able thinke one good thought although god gouerne v although hee woorke v yet alwayes ſome faultineſſe v wee mingle owne infirmity ſuch ſort grace holy ſpirite euer proceedeth v defyled deſerue aught god hande bee foraſmuche hauing called v hee ſpareth v forgiueth v vyces mingled good deſire wee haue ſerue hee doeth ſtill rewarde faythfull haue indeuered followe ſay hee rewardeth worlde ſheweth hee ſhet eye good zeale ſubmit themſelues alloweth lifteth well ye ſee god manifeſteth ordinarie rightuouſneſſe fauouring thoſe haue fully ſubmitted themſelues vnto leaſtwiſe ſo farforth weakneſſe fleſh wil beare ſay fully meene perfectly poynts vnfeynedly according alſo holy ſcripture ſpeaketh contrariwiſe god puniſheth whoremonger theeues drunkard euen alſo ordinarie rightuouſneſſe ſee wicked man ſhal haue fleeced neighbor played cruell beaſt eating vp deuouring mennes goodes god bloweth vpon hys ſubſtance ſo nothing remayneth ſame true ſhew god iuſtice aſſured warrant euyll gottē good waſt away maketh v acknowledge god iudge againe murtherers puniſhed likewiſe conſider written cruel man ſhall liue halfe dayes ſo alſo wyth miſdooers vve ſee howe ſcorners ſcoffe god repine aduaunce themſelues againſt exceſsiue rage god ouerthroweth sith wee ſee wicked ſo puniſhed alreadie thys worlde ought thinke god ſheweth himſelfe iudge ſo ought heare ſtande vp vpon head perceyue ſtretch arme ſo mightely execute iuſtice thus ye ſee god ordinarie iuſtice wit iuſtice perceyue executed according conteyned law herewithall ſee alſo good men afflicted god impoueriſheth ſuche haue indeuered walke ſoundly man giuen wickedneſſe dooth neuertheleſſe iinger paine life long ſo hath much ado go vpon legges commeth paſſe cauſe vve cannot tell neither able determine god reſerueth reaſon himſelfe therefore poynt ordinarie iuſtice neither muſt meaſured one rate againe ſee wicked proſperitie onely day two hath bin ſayd afore time life yea euē die laughter go away ſleepe taken worlde turning hande without long pyning ſuffering much paine meeneth truly muſt blame god vnrightuouſneſſe wee muſt ſharpen tongue agaynſt behoueth v knowe hee hath higher kinde iuſtice rightuouſneſſe wit reache vntoo wee neuer atteyne vntoo reaſon muſt ſtill hidden v neuertheleſſe wee muſt ceſſe honour ſecrete iudgements ſubmit ſelues vnto wayting till diſcloſe thing vntoo v hee reſerueth yet himſelfe hys owne ſecrete determination lo howe god hideth men right according whiche wee haue ſayde man bee puniſhed ſort bee ſayde hee wicked perſone yet hee ſo true men ſinners god might iuſtly deſtroy v damne v hee liſted doo reknowledgeth owne rightuous layeth ſinnes theyr charge true alſo bee acquitte behoueth condemne themſelues god yet hee acquit ſoeuer worlde go notwithſtanding chaſtizeth meane purpoſe deſtroy vndoo hee hydeth right ſay hee ſheweth openly hee accounteth child hath forgiuen offence yet hath done notwithſtanding wit able comprehende furthermore let v marke alſo iob hath eye vntoward miſweening falſe opinion mē conceyue beeing ouerhaſtie tarie paciently till god ſhew wherefore afflicteth thoſe ſo diſcrete modeſt giue ſentence condemnation vpon ſuch afflicted ſhould find god proceeding ſtrange neyther ſhould wee ſay god withholdeth right aſſoone ſee poore man greatly afflicted euery one v ruſh condemne perplexity therefore cauſe mannes right buryed ſeeming god ought firſt daſhe maynteyne cace ſuche one ryghtmynded neuertheleſſe hee doth maketh countenance otherwiſe hee reſerueth iudgement himſelfe ſuffering men iudge amiſſe v ſpeake amiſſe v abhorre v letting v alone plight good ouerwhelmed marke cauſe ſayde make rightuouſneſſe ſeruants ſhine foorth breake day giuing promiſe much ſay ſhall alwayes bee perfourmed eyeſight behoueth v oftentymes abyde ſhame reproche yea sainct paule himſelfe ſheweth ſay euen hee liued angelicall perfectneſſe ſheweth hee ſubiect therevnto onely caſt vp many ſlaunderous reproches touching owne priuate life alſo miſreported touching office inſomuch whereas handled doctrine faythfully purely yet notwithſtanding men ſo vnthankefull ceaſſed report euill vvell ſayth appeale day lorde come hee ſheweth oftentymes worlde ſhall bee trouble mencioned heere ſo man ſhall bee able diſcerne betweene whyte blacke beſt ſeruers god ſhall bee ſlaundered wronged bycauſe men ſee afflicted alwayes conſter euill part according mannes inclination giuen miſdeeming let v marke well god doeth bereeue men iudgement appeareth firſt brunt eyther defende v ſhewe holdeth v rightuous hee taketh cace hande ſuffereth v bee condemned men finally increaſeth affliction therevppon men harden themſelues agaynſt v ſay become ſo peruerſe iudge thing contrarie grounde gather ſo much boldeneſſe ſaying may well ſay may men ſee ſtill howe handled thus yee ſee good men ouerſore oppreſſed god ſhrinketh aſide maketh countenaunce accounting rightuous rather ſeemeth warre agaynſt intende condemne aboue others ſee iob blaſphemed god ſaying bereft right ſee ſort behoueth v make profit excellent doctrine let v vnderſtande god may oftentymes bereeue v right yet ſhall haue whereof accuſe complaine neyther ſhall wee amende cace pleading againſt hath ſecrete rightuouſneſſe behoueth v honour till make v knowe minde exerciſe v yet lowlineſſe worketh ſo ſtraunge faſhion towards v cannot vnderſtande hee doth keepe v awe make v glorifie ſaying true lord heere poore blinde ſoule darke ſee whit behalfe yet art thou rightuous although thy iudgements bottomleſſe pit cace ſo cānot enter yea although good buried death yet confeſſe thee rightuous ô lorde vvhen go ſo worke haue wee profited affliction god ſendeth v whereof reaſons apparant vntoo v furthermore let v practiſe iob ſayeth god bereeue v iudgement muſt therefore forbeare holde alwayes god humble ſelues vnder maieſtie according ſayde lorde liueth hath bereft iudgement euen almightie hath ſet ſoule anguiſh iob playeth reſtie horſe although haue double anguiſhe yet knoweth hee well god hath dominion ſuperioritie ouer woulde ſay god liueth except honour hee ſhoulde ſay lorde thy ſillie creature thou haſt power ouer mee ſayd double affliction thing ought marke well wee haue ſeene howe hee perſecuted goodes perſone ſo indured much poſsible mortal wight indure yet another affliction hee tormented ſuch came moue deſpayre paſſed miſeries haue ſayde god hateth thee thou ſeeſt well ynough thou haſt acceſſe vain thee looke eaſe hand hee agaynſt thee giueth thee ſure token afflicting thee maner vvhat ſhouldeſt thou condemne thy whole life afore paſſed thou wilt haue mercie god hande thou muſt chaunge altogither acknowledge hitherto thou haſt beene ſtarke naught mocker god man full hypocriſie lewdneſſe thus ye ſee two affliction iob indured yet notwithſtanding honored god ſtill ſweareth name howbeeit men nowe adayes whiche blaſpheme god ſwearing doubtleſſe elſe othes ſworne adayes moſt part reproches vnto god deſpizing name like man ſweare aduenture ſheweth well hee regardeth name god ought holy ſight whenſoeuer wee heare ſpeaking wee ought caſt downe oure heades acknowledge infinite glorie contrarywiſe name god runneth roundly mouthes way mockage therefore looke many light othes man maketh ſo many reproches iniuries wherewith hee diſgraceth name god againe alſo forſwearings yet heynous ſo muche man hath invred himſelfe ſweare fooliſhly goeth foreward falſifie truth turne lie name god ſhall run ſuch wiſe ſhall bee pleaſure men think vpon iob ſwearing eye principall poynt whiche wee ſweare name god muſt acknowledge bee iudge yeelding due authoritie ſetting ſelues throne cōdemned haue done amiſſe vve ſee iob acknowledgeth affliction come god hande dealeth ſtubbornly hee kicketh agaynſt mayſter like reſtie iade humbleth himſelfe ſayeth god liueth howſoeuer world goeth true ſee ſelfe forlorne man indure ſo much impoſsible mee ſo pacient ought bee yet ſo deſperate play mad bedlem ſay knowe god would would let alone power ouer contrarywiſe know iudge haue authoritie imbrace mightie power hath ouer hold alwayes vnder hand acknowledging affliction bee ſending therfore without cauſe haue ſayd haue excellent doctrine taught firſt acquaint ſelues chaſtizement correction god hand vvherefore happen tempted deſpayre feele ſuch fearfulneſſe ſelues think ſelues alreadie hell let v acknowledge owne frailtie leane vnto namely god hydeth iudgement bereeueth v ſuch wiſe right ſeeme ſelues forlorne paſt al recouery vvell god hideth away right done muſt caſt downe heades tarie till god lift v vp chin redreſſe ſtate ſet v vp againe mainteyne cace ſo oppreſſed turmoyled men folke bleare tung v make ieaſtingſtock v yet muſt loſe courage ſee example ſet v behold faythful ought come practize profite themſelues although cannot conceyue reaſon thing god doth yet neuertheleſſe muſt always become ſo lowly ſay lord deale thou v ſhall pleaſe thee therewithall giue v power prayſe thee alwayes thy workes ſay lord liueth although confounded thus ye ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne eaſie v knowe thing conteyned ſith haue comprized whole ſumme need ioyne cloze ſentences followe vnto iob ſayth ſo long liueth ſhall paſſe deceyte wicked worde mouth hereby ſheweth ſpeaketh preſence god thing well worthie noted haue tolde oftentimes expounding booke ouercommon vice among men marreth ſo wedded world neuer come preſence god examine themſelues men blame v falſly reſt ſo much vpon enter ſelues examine ſelues god done cleane contrarie anſwere men well let v firſt accuſe ſelues let v fully reſolued vpon conſcience god without hauing eie one man cauſe hypocrite al doings take ſo much paine couer colour fault woulde fayne keepe ſtill good reputation credite haue among men contrariwiſe iob ſheweth hee ſetteth himſelfe preſence god although ſpeake men yet hee forepoſſeſſed ſo fooliſh ambition pretend vtterly blame leſſe iudgeth himſelfe god according hee findeth conſcience ſo layeth forth matter openly let v mark euill thing bee deuized reſt ſo vpon men begin poynt ſay iudge ſelues preſence god ne haue eye ſhet world ward reſpect opinion men conceyue v thing layde vpon v therefore without hauing reſpect ſuch thing behoueth v conſider ſelues ſuch cace god ſhall bee rightly meekened ſpeake feynedly diſguyze thing knowing well gaine nothing ſo marke one poynt let v marke well maner ſpeach iob vſeth long ſayeth ſhall winde breath ſo long ſpirite god nozethrilles ſpeaketh life though hilde without grace god true may ſay thing common ynough man denie bee beholden god breath liuelineſſe haue yet howe many acknowledge good earneſt men liue ſo brutiſh faſhion might ſayde take themſelues ſuſteyned themſelues owne power bee ſhort know rightly paule meaneth ſaying haue life mouing beeing god verie fewe ſay know therefore let v marke well iob ſheweth v hee caryed away many men ſo dazeled paſsions haue skill neyther know ſay true vndiſcrete woordes eſcaped wee haue ſeene ſhall ſee hereafter yet neuertheleſſe hee alwayes hilde himſelfe vpon good foundation although buylding ſutable ſame yet ſay hilde himſelfe feare awe god lette v marke well circumſtance iob ſpeaketh owne leyſure eaſe yee ſee hee ſuch affliction god ſeemeth bee fully determined deſtroy vtterly yet honoreth ſtill life acknowledging bee partie hee hath lyfe pray excuſe ſhall wee haue bee fully reſolued thereof ſith god giueth v releace make v mindefull grace wee acknowledge confeſſe life euer dependeth therevpon proceede grace power shall wee bee vnexcuſable oft wee thinke vpon life let v remember behoueth v make ſame confeſsion iob maketh namely neyther blaſt breath mee myne owne power god hath giuen euerywhit true iob ſpeaketh god ſpirite muſt imagin phantaſticall ſort thinke ſubſtance god ſpirite abhominable hereſie behoueth v alwayes marke ſuche manner ſpeaches holy scripture ende fall ſuch hereſie ſay god ſpirite v touching verie ſubſtance thing ſhould inſue god ſpirite ſubiect ignorance chaunge mutabilitie yea defiled ſteyned ſinnes vyces yet neuertheleſſe haue ſayde poynt hath ſore troubled chriſten church like vnhappie heretike puniſhed conceyte ſay men ſoules parttakers ſubſtance godhead thing ſo horrible agaynſt nature man muſt needes vtterly growne kinde ere come let v marke ſpeaking god ſpirite importeth ſubſtance v ment breathing ſay inſpireth v power according ſee sunne abydeth skie yet brightneſſe beames doth ſuch wiſe come v inioy light heate much ſay therefore holde sunne beneath good ſooth ſee sunne power hee ſheadeth downe hither cheereth earth ſuch wiſe beareth frute yeeldeth ſuſtenance nouriſhment men ſhall incomprehenſible power god himſelfe ſpirit cannot ſame ſpread ſelfe euen vnto v yet notwithſtanding haue ſubſtance let v marke well verie ſubſtance god ſpirite v power ſhed forth ſuch wiſe liue confirmed meanes thereof knowing behoueth v holde life god according onely holde thing grace holy ſpirite vvherefore let v conſider wee ought acknowledge god grace thing concerne preſent life much ought wee ſeeke thing belong endleſſe life thing whervnto calleth v ſhewing v muſt alwayes labour thitherward till haue deliuered v bandes let preſent life nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying bring v ſo lure know ſinnes may alwayes giue glorie prayſe doubting hee ſcourge v ſame welfare ſoulehealth yet notwithſtanding let v learne ſubmit ſelues ſo farre vnto wee may ſuffer ſelues brought nothing ſelues may ſtrengthened hande yea ſo ſtrongly mightily may bee able withſtand temptation power meane lorde ieſus chriſt ſo life death may alwayes find v obedient child according hee ſheweth himſelfe mercifull father towardes v may pleaſe giue grace onely v c xcviij sermon ſecond vpon xxvij chapter 5 god forbid ſhould iuſtifie vvill neuer giue ouer mine innocencie till till die 6 vvill keepe rightuouſneſſe forſake heart ſhall vpbrayde mee vvith dayes 7 curſed gainſayeth mee vvicked rizeth vp agaynſt mee 8 vvhat hope hypocrite vvhen hath heaped vp god plucketh avvay ſoule iob declared minde concerning hee ſayde ſhewed hee blaſphemed god onely ment affliction befell reaſon ſinnes ſome extraordinarie purpoſe god hidden men hee proteſteth hee ſtande ſtedfaſtly ſame minde behoueth v marke well dealing ſettle ſelues determinately vpon thing whereof well aſſured aforehand poynt wherein wilfull ſort doo differ good allowable conſtant ſort vndiſcrete perſon ſuch one weyeth thing good reaſon aduiſement conceyue toy head neuer bee remoued yet ſhall ſuch one bee named conſtant therfore neither deſerueth commended worſe poynt mainteyne thing without knowing commonly ſayd fooles bolt ſoone ſhot haſtie iudging alſo wilfull mainteyning muſt needes vnrecouerable foole therefore let v mark well iobs proceeding firſt declared intent ſhewed himſelfe imbrewed falſe opinion haue errour ſayde ſpoken pure truth declaring hee addeth proteſtation neuer remoued purpoſe knoweth rightfull iuſt whenſoeuer wee come iudging thing let v looke neerely ſift throughly haue skill ynough behoueth v always acknowledge rawneſſe infirmitie let v pray god giue v ſpirite skilfulneſſe diſcretion thing wel knowne v ſo fully reſolued let v wauer great ſhame wilfull perſons ſhoulde ſtick ſo faſt fond imagination cannot bee drawne ſhould ſo ſoone remoued truth know neede none witneſſes iudges condemne raſhneſſe vnconſtancie wilfull ſort haue bin ſo wedded owne wit haue allowed thing ſticke ſtoutely cannot meanes wonne pray done thoſe god hath giuen knowledge truth ought leaſtwiſe imbrace ſticke ſtedfaſtly yea ſtande fully reſolued vpon much ſoeuer men labour draw lo two poynts haue marke ſtreyne one ſhould haſtie mainteyne thing haue skil whereof well aſſured ſhoulde firſt looke diſcrete iudge wel rightly ſo ſay know matter perfectly wee ſure truth let v take courage ſticke whatſoeuer come let v ſhaken declareth v true nature fayth beleeue vpon fickle opinion leaſtwiſe well grounded god truth ſuch ſay beleeue meanewhile haue certaintie god truth onelye ſome imagination certaine bee bewitched satan leaſtwiſe wedded men ſay behold turkes ſufficiently hardened errours ought faſtneſſe rather ſteelineſſe counted ſayth certaintie behoueth v vnderſtand hold doctrine wit holde god muſt fully perſwaded hath called v ſchole vvell haue ſayde certaintie vvee muſt immediatly match purpoſe perſeuer many howe euery blaſt forget haue learned afore aſſoone heare newe thing wote whereby ſhewe neuer ſo much taſt god truth vvhat bee done haue ſayde thing knowe good muſt neuer eſcape v nother muſt wee meanes bee turned wee muſt ſo print heartes may ſtande ende thus ye ſee alreadie haue remember text furthermore whereas iob ſayeth god forbid euer ſhoulde instifie let v marke alſo ſmall fault god make countenaunce conſenting ſuche mainteyne euill cace go agaynſt truth although man doo heart bee otherwyſe mynded himſelfe yet god blaſphemed therein knowe great ſtore hee ſetteth truth maynteyne euill cace ſet themſelues agaynſt truth deface go wicked practize wee doo onely make countenance cleaue vnto partaker certayne wee bee guiltie ſame wickedneſſe god ſo much better ought wee minde leſſon foraſmuch nowe adayes wee ſee moſt men make bone agree wicked leaſtwyſe beare good countenaunce although miſlike euill doings although woulde faine amended yet notwithſtanding auoyding diſpleaſure ſhift ſuch battelles ſeene make countenance bow yeelde vntoo oft ſee wicked aflote haue full ſcope fayne vale bonnet although vphold euill ful mouth yet ſo farre ſpeaking agaynſt man woulde thinke adherent conſenters vvee ſee ſo ordinarie worlde nowe adayes verie rufull man ſteppes vp maynteyne good quarelles rather common excuſe ſay meddle ouerhaſtily ſee ſhall bring ſelfe brier euery manne bee toppe make mine owne cace wee woorthie bee ſhaken god hande wee bee loth mainteyne truth wilfull renouncing god ſeparating oure ſelues ſette purpoſe wee giue token wee iuſtifie wicked like euill cace thinke wee doo become without cauſe iob ſpeaketh heere ſuche vehemencie ſay god forbidde abhorreth iuſtifying vnrightuouſneſſe thing exceeding heynous muche ouerturne whole order god hath ſette heere yee ſee alſo prophete eſay pronounceth ſo terrible curſe agaynſt ſuch cal good euill euill good hee ſayth turning light intoo darkneſſe another poynt wee haue marke ſtreyne god forbid ſayeth iob euer ſhould iuſtifie confirmeth matter yet better adding anon curſed mought aduerſarie true betweene thoſe twoo verſes thirde neuertheleſſe bee good matche theſe two ſentences togither curſed ſayeth hee mought mine aduerſarie bee wicked bee hee ryzeth vp agaynst mee firſt hee ſheweth himſelfe bee full ſure hold hee ſpiteth ſuch ſhall intende ſtriue againſt defieth warre true harebraynde perſon peraduenture vſe lyke ſtoutneſſe aduaunce himſelf agaynſt whole world without ſhrinking awhitte haue tolde afore iob buylded without laying ſure ſteadie foundation fully reſolued god truth whereas nowe defyeth ſuch would fight agaynſt ſheweth ſuch caces playing handes beeing neuter rowe betwene two ſtreames wee muſt bee either one ſide without fleeting fro march true ſoundneſſe ſaying god cace muſt v aduocates mainteyne haue conceyued wicked quarell token matter againſt truth let v labour thruſt downe let ſuffered diſſemble wee cannot denie traytours god ſee zeale ought bee v onely confeſſe truth knowe ſhewe hold good alſo withſtande errours falſe wicked opinion becōmeth v inflamed ſuch ſtoutneſſe ſhewed v perſone iob let v marke well doctrine ſaluation thing belong god ſeruice religion come queſtion muſt onely admitte know good true yea euen teachable obedient minde alſo wee muſt ſhunne falſe opinion contrarie truth lyable vnto ſay wee muſt reſiſt fiercely declare ſuch gainſay v agree v wicked curſed ſay bee hilde hand enimies rightuouſneſſe truth bycauſe refuze ioyne v obeying god become rebelles reiect truth seeing ſeparate themſelues wiſe god ſo breake true bande vnitie behoueth v haue open warre wiſe agree deſirous pleaſure wicked would faine holde therefore prouerbe ſayeth holde hare hunte hounde ſhewe themſelues beare two face one hood play two partes enterlude without chaunging apparell god abyde ſuch counterfeyting therefore let v remember well ſayde heere namely matter ſtandeth onely ſaying contented ſuche thing ſhall paſſe ſtriue agaynſt truth ſhewe ſelues like well god truth wee muſt maynteyne hande ſuch ſet themſelues againſt v muſt enimies muſt deteſt aſſuring ſelues agreement betweene truth vntruth betweene fire water marke wee haue yet note iob addeth hart ſhall vpbrayde dayes ſtep aſide hee go backe touching hebrewe worde may taken offer reproch may alſo bee taken wexe yong againe therevpon commeth bee taken recoyle returne backe ſignification agreeth verie well hee ſayeth heart ſhall retyre backe though wexed yong againe howe dayes ſay time lyfe haue paſſed bee ſhort iob ment betoken would neuer ſwarue like continued vnto day ſerue god yea euen ſoundneſſe ſo would thenceforth ſteppe aſide runne backe become another man would alwayes founde ſame beene knowne according haue declared alreadie namely foraſmuch god hath beene ſo gracious v inlighten v ſuch wiſe diſcerne betwene good euill knowe ought followe behoueth v take heede wee bee fleeting lyke wauering reedes wee hold owne ſtedfaſtly let v looke well ſelues whenſoeuer god ſhall haue ſet v good way let v turne ſayle backe againe let v go forward ſtill yea looke howe much man hath gone forewarde let knowe god hath bounde ſo much ſtedfaſt ſhame heynouſer vnthankefulneſſe hee turne backe forſake good way verely ſoone god ſheweth v behoueth v bee taken loue indeuer profite neuer ſtep aſide therfore euen firſt day wee ought bee inflamed follow god truth ſoone ſhewed v god hath bene ſo gracious man leade forth moneth onely yeare three ten ſo hee hath liued long knowledge god owne ſaluation afterwarde become rebell renegate holde laſt ſteppe farre greater fault man hath yet taken good ſufficient deepe roote ſhoulde turne away ouerſhoote himſelfe throughe ſome lightneſſe man haue taſted good anon turne away verely ſhall excuſed god yet men haue pitie vpon ſo turned away hee haue receyued full inſtruction man hath followed right way long time hath ſeemed bee conſtanter ſort yet withdrawne excuſe thus ye ſee iob ment expreſſe ſtreyne ſhewing ſeeing god giuen grace walke aright long time knowne good heart ſhoulde turne backe againe let euery v learne example conſider well free fauour god ſheweth v hee vouchſafeth draw v pure fayth goſpell behoueth v thinke hath bound v vnto ſo ſolemneſt couenants worlde paſſed betwixt v vvherfore let v ſettle ſelues hold ende haue begonne well let v followe way god hath ſet v aſſuring ſelues hath reached hand vnto v let euerie v recken well time long ago ſince knew god truth howe yeare three ten twentie ſince god diſcloſed himſelfe vnto mee haue profited ſince time although haue gone ſo farre forewarde requiſite yet much god hath taken intoo houſe ſuffered mee runne quite away hath graunted grace holde hitherto thing ſhoulde nowe renounce giue ouer ouerdamnable vnthankefulneſſe lo howe euery man ought call himſelfe account may confirme himſelfe ſtedfaſtneſſe iob ſheweth v owne perſone poynt wee haue marke ſhort wee ſee ſtreyne lawfull chriſtians wyſe diſſemble making countenance beleeue thing whiche notwithſtanding condemne reaſon whereof aſſured euill neither muſt vſe ſtartingholes colour ſoeuer pretende ſhall alwayes bee condemned hypocriſie god loueth truth ſetteth ſo great ſtore haue v ſticke ſoeuer come euen common matter although thing ſeeme import preiudice harme wrong yet man ſay hee beleeues bee ſo meane findeth cleane contrarie heart excuſed whenſoeuer doctrine ſaluation ſeruing honoring god higheſt thing bee come queſtion wee muſt take leaue libertie ſwarue behalfe euen worldly matter behoueth v acknowledge ſelues faultie wee make countenance conſenting vnto miſlike vſe ſuche ſhiftes god truth impugned facing falſe wicked thing beſides betray god wee alſo indeuer much v lyeth robbe thing hath ſo knit vnto himſelfe ſeparated except renounce himſelfe ſay truth ſo let v marke well ſhewed v heere example iob namely lorde hath bene ſo gracious v giue v fayth harte behoueth v haue mouth open make confeſsion wee beleeue ſure preach ſame due time place wee ſee men ſet themſelues agaynſt doctrine wee knowe bee true let v reſiſt vttermoſt power maynteyne god quarell except wee intend bee falſe although doctrine deſerue bee ſet length yet notwithſtanding whiche haue compryſed alreadie ſmall roume ſufficient let euery man thinke howe hee may fare better whole matter conſiſteth practizing let v come nowe iob addeth vvhat hope hypocrite ſayth ſeeing heaping vp goodes god plucketh away ſoule iob proteſteth hee opinion god puniſheth men ſinnes worlde aſleepe openeth eies letteth thing ſlippe ſuch wize heere bylowe thing vniuerſally turmoyled thing ſayeth hee muſt come account ende howbeit men perceyue god iudgements eyeſight firſt daſh effect matter iob declareth behoueth v alwayes beare minde haue ſeene afore party ſtroue agaynſt iob vphilde men handled according deſerts god doth euermore ſhew himſelf good louing mercifull towardes ſuche ſeeke loue contrarywiſe forthwith vttereth rygor vengeance againſt ſuch deſpiſe ſpecially bend themſelues againſt ſtray good way ſee contrarie namely good afflicted ſeeme haue god enimie bicauſe hee dealeth exceeding roughly meane ſee wicked liue delight pleaſures triumphing though god hilde nicely lap vvhat meeneth ende meane ſhould perceyue god doth execute iuſtice fully reſerueth well reward good men puniſhment wicked men vnto laſt day life iob therefore declareth although ſayd afore god puniſheth wicked afflicteth godly ſeemeth vſe exceſsiue crueltie againſt ſuch haue deſerued contrarywiſe flatter vngodly yet notwithſtanding intendeth rob god office ſhoulde alwayes bee iudge worlde watche gouerne ſtate earth howe muſt certaine day ſet neither muſt hee bee ſummoned dutie houre behoueth v tarie leyſure paciently make v ſee example iuſtice one way ſumme iob ment declare although haue ſeene doctrine heretofore yet muſt irke v haue oftentymes repeated conſidering one chiefe poynts wee ought ſticke vntoo namely euen middes trouble thys worlde ought neuertheleſſe aſſure ſelues god ſuffereth thing runne hauocke holdeth wicked although hee ſpare forbeare puniſh time yet neuer better taking alwayes vnhappie ſecret vengeance prepared ſo farre better god ſhould puniſh firſt puſh ſo deferre puniſhment whiche appeareth preſently vvherefore let v learne thing needefull may bee throughly perſwaded although godly afflicted yet ceaſſe happie inaſmuch haue recourſe god bow downe neckes bearing yoke laid vpon ſure though god trie obedientneſſe yet ceaſſeth loue vvhen wee perſwaded wee haue profited greatly whole time life good ſooth let v looke vpon infirmitie v ſoone haue temptation ſo abaſhed diſmayd comforting v wee ſee wicked proſper god beareth wee woulde hee ſhould nothing v grating teeth ſeemeth v hope v bee vtterly deceyued calling vpon god ſeruing againe ſtate ſuch fleſhe woulde wiſh courage quayleth yea fall fretting chafing agaynſt god finally wee bee ſo combered wee cannot aſſure ſelues behoofe reſort vntoo god middes miſeries aſſwage ſorrowes knowe alwayes ſauiour father vvherefore let v fight againſt infirmitie may fully reſolued thereof alſo contrary ſee proſperitie wicked let v faint let v alwayes plucke vp good hart aſſuring ſelues god doth fat oxe hog man intendeth kill oxe fat hee beſtowe coſt vpon prepareth bee drawne ſlaughterhouſe purpoſeth labour plough like hog lorde handleth wicked men worlde ox swine fatteth pampereth till burſt againe deſtruction foraſmuch abuſe goodneſſe pacience heape vp ſtore wrath whereof paule ſpeaketh defiling benefites receyue god hande time ſo bountifull ſeeing doctrine ſo profitable vntoo v ſide hard comprehended let v thinke ſtraunge often repeating wee haue neede record leſſon oft bycauſe wee vnderſtand firſt ſight yea haue profited well life long haue begon well conceyue forget againe though bee dayly rehearſed vnto v nowe let v come iobs wordes vvhat hope hypocrite ſhal haue heaped vp god ſhall take away ſoule theſe wordes iob ſignifieth wee muſt incloſe man happineſſe within preſent life howe may wee ſay men happie vnhappie muſt haue eye faſtened vpon world verie narrow bound muſt go death poynt lord ſheweth v purpoſe v haue liued heere eaſe haue ho orded vp much goodes haue beene honour credite haue crammed ſelues quietneſſe bee ſhort haue wiſhes heere god ſay ſheweth death al geere flightfull vaniſhing ſhadowe therefore iudge rightly men ſtates whether happie vnhappie let v looke onely liuing dealt withall twentie thirtie fiftie yeares let v conſider men paſſe hence god calleth according ſayde ninetith pſalme god cauſeth make one turne though ranne ring come home yee ſonnes menne ſayeth hee marke haue conceyue firſt place end bee ouertaken falſe opinion bee whiche thinke vpon preſent lyfe rauiſhed incontinentlie ſoone ſee one riche ſay hath ſo much good hath ſo much fayre landes nothing triumphing hee well houſed hee hath mony purſe agayne ſuch one greate credite well freended greatly allyed another counted wiſe ſo euery man ſtoupeth lo eye ſhall dazeled rather ſeeled vp ſo ſhall diſcerne wee thinke vpon worlde therefore let v beare minde ſayde namely god ſheweth death purpoſe haue liued eaſe world ſtate men bee eſteemed thereby fonde iudgement iob ſayeth expreſly although wicked man haue heaped vp neuer ſo muche ſay put cace life man euer poſsible wiſhed yet muſt thinke better cace therfore ſhall become ſayeth iob god ſhall plucke away ſoule woorde plucke ſheweth deathe wicked alwayes forcible yea truely although good rotten worlde ſo god ſuffer liue till age cōſume droupe halfe ſcore yeeres die although die exceeding old full yeeres yet plucked awaye vvhat reaſon firſte bycauſe yeeld themſelues god ſecōdly bicauſe neuer knew ende put world wit ende ſhould called away againe vntoo god muche leſſe ſure heauenly life euerlaſting heritage prepared v thus doo wicked men want three thing whiche haue skill obey god ſuffer themſelues bee gouerned knowe end creation wit put wold vpon condition ſhoulde onely paſſe finally wote heauenly life place muſte haue reſte foraſmuche wicked haue comprehended theſe three thing maruell thoughe plucked worlde god fayne hale hēce force ſo go willing minde contrariwiſe faythfull beeing contented haue lyued knowledge depart world willingly receiue full fruition thing promiſed whiche hope wicked therefore plucked away yet wee wey matter well thing againſt nature plucked away ſo although ſayde ſturdineſſe ſpake bee vnbeleeuers yet notwithſtanding god hath diuerſe time inforced paynim vtter ſuche wordes declare v bee vnexcuſable wee ſhunne death wiſe much wedded preſent life like iudge wyll inforce offender conſeſſe haue holding vpon racke euen ſo ſayde afore god hath force wreſted confuſion paynim ſhewe ſuche die willingly quyet harte monſters turne nature quyte vpſyde downe heathenman neuer hearde one woorde good doctrine tolde death ſonne anſwered knowe begate mortall lo heere confeſsion made heathen man whiche ynough condemne whole worlde muche hee ſayde ſith god hath ſet v heere behoueth v wayte ſorte pleaſeth diſpoze v ſo liſt take v hence ought acknowledge life muſte bee ſubiecte another heathen man ſayeth beholde worlde ſette bee watchman caſtle ſayde ſouldier come hither go thither ſo hath god ſet v worlde condition call v hence liſteth heathen men haue ſpoken ſorte ſufficient witneſſes condemne al ſuch reply ſette colour vpon lewde affection cace excuſe furthermore haue ſayde alreadie lette v marke thoſe heathenmen ſpake ſo conſtraynte god thing done ende ſhoulde haue oure condemnation written pronounced wee agree wyll nowe done wee diſpoſe ſelues dye willingly go reſt ſelues god lette v learne knowe vice hinder v remedy redreſſe firſte lette v learne ſubmit ſelues vnto god let v ſo frowarde madde wiſhe exempt ſelues ſubiection created ſhaped v behold firſt thing whervnto behoueth faithfull ſort apply thēſelues acknowledge ende wee created ſhaped beholde god hath ſoueraine dominion ouer v therefore behoueth v ſubmit ourſelues vnto dedicate ourſelues ſo wholly ſeruice wee may alwayes life death vvhen man ſo ſubmit himſelfe god reuerence low lineſſe ſo renounce himſelf ſay mete creator ſhold haue vpper hand thee thy maiſter good beginning truely leſſon might holde v tacke three dayes yea three moneths ynough v wee knowe effecte whiche haue touched euery man may thinke vppon leyſure ye ſee firſte leſſon whiche ſtandeth v hande muze vppon wee minde liue die quietly bee plucked worlde force violence ſubmit ſelues god good ſeconde wee know ende intent wee bee put worlde without wee brute beaſtes oxe knoweth wherefore god created nother doo beaſtes alſo man cannot bee excuſed hath witte reaſon god calleth worlde intent ſhoulde knowe lyfe wayfaring brute beaſtes knowe deathe tyll menne haue brought cut throtes till die ſome miſchaunce doo diſcerne betweene life death men haue vnderſtanding thereof yea lorde doth dayly ſet mirrours frayltie eye nowe wee thinke vpon pray wee tooto brutiſhe nay whiche woorſe brute beaſtes muſte condemne v although oxe know wherefore created yet doth ſtill folowe ſome order nature vvhy holdeth horne boweth necke yoke bicauſe lorde hath giuen leſſon withoute wyll withoute vnderſtanding ſo poore beaſte hath inclination doo whiche duetie ſhamefull thing men meane ſtubborne ox horſes aſſes lette v learne wherefore god hath ſette v this▪ worlde purpoſe liue heere wit ende wee ſhoulde knowe wee bee ſet iourney wee bee lodged ſuſteyned heere earth god coſte therefore muſte hang wholly vpon grace feeling bee oure sauiour father according hee ſheweth himſelfe towardes v dooings wee bee gyuen ſerue thus ye ſee ſeconde poynte wee haue beare minde wee purpoſe die willingly bee plucked hence violente force god hande thirde cheefeſt heauenly lyfe death alwayes terrible v ſelfe wee cannot afrayde man doth ſpeake v wee ſtryken ſome aſtoniſhment wee doo thinke therefore sainct paule ſayeth wee deſire death impoſsible man brought deſire die ſhunne much poſsible god hath imprinted feeling v deathe curſe diffeating nature changing god order whiche man ſinned wee cannot ſhunne death euen bycauſe contrarie fleſhe terror thereof diſmayeth v reaſon knowledge god hath giuen v therefore sainct paule forealleadged chapter ſayeth deſire death reſpect ſelfe bicauſe know yet wee tranſitorie dwellingplaces vvhat bodie ſo corruptible thing leaues tree ſo ſoone rotten wee knowe houſe prepared v wee bee reſtored heauenly glorie wee ſhall lodged little ſhedde vnder leaues ſoone rotten euerlaſting houſe full glorie seeing knowe god calleth v ſo happie lyfe gyueth v aſſurance oure lorde ieſus chriſte wee neede ſhunne death ſith therby enter full poſſeſsion ſaluation ſhorte wee come death vnbeleuers vnbeleeuers ſay know whither go haue opinion immortalitie ſoules eyther muſte needes bee diſmayed know god ſhall theyr iudge elſe ſhall ſotted ſuch wiſe ſhall thinke better lyfe parte behoueth v know god hath created v owne image likeneſſe intente gather v vp himſelfe wee ſhoulde bee ſure wee referre ſelues wholly vnto following example oure lorde ieſus chriſte ſheweth v father ſayeth • ee vnto thee commende ſpirite lette v learne ſaye freely vnto god lorde yeelde ſoule thy handes thus yee ſee howe wee ſhall bee ſafe wee knowe god keeper ſoules thus ye ſee ſhall go gladly good vnto death bycauſe ſoules god keeping till knit theyr body agayne comming laſte daye vvhen wee bee poynt confirme ſayde prayer withall thou mayſt adde thou haſt redeemed ô lorde god truth lo howe dauid ſpeaketh ieſus chriſt hath vſed ſame ſhew requeſte whiche oughte bee common member church ende doubt god receyuing ſoules keeping betake vnfaynedly let v know god truth ſo muche hee ſuffer v periſhe whatſoeuer befall v ſo wee haue heart minde put ourſelues handes nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente ſinnes praying haue pitie vppon v wretched creature bycauſe wee ſo loth followe ſheweth v may pleaſe ſtabliſh v ſuch zeale holy spirite wee may neuer ſwarue turned right way wherein ſhall haue ſet v aſmuch ſo long liue worlde inclined yea giuen vp many vice imperfection lette v pray graunt v grace reſiſte ſuch wiſe hee may bee glorified oure confeſsing name whyther bee lyfe deathe meane whyle wee may bee knitte fayth hope ſo wee may perſiſte therein ende vntill hee haue gathered v euerlaſting heritage whiche purchaſed v oure lorde ieſus chriſte may pleaſe graunte grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorante ſoules miſerable bondage errour darkeneſſe right way ſaluation whereof may pleaſe rayſe c xcix sermon third vpon xxvij chapter 8 vvhat hope hypocrite vvhen ſhall haue heaped vp god ſhall haue plucked avvay soule 9 vvill god heare crye vvhen trouble commeth vpon 10 vvill ſet delyght almightie vvill hee call vpon god time 11 vvill teach vvhat hande god vvill conceale vvhat vvith almightie 12 beholde yee haue ſeene theſe thing vvhy yee vaniſhe avvay vanitie ſawe yeſterday iudge ſtate men wee muſt reſt vpon preſent life muſt go loke thā life man ſhall ſee ſhadow although graūted hart deſire ſo god wold giue whatſoeuer wold wiſh al ſmoke paſſeth away hand therfore behoueth v come hope iob ſpeaketh heere may haue skill diſcerne whither man life happie vnhappie hee bringeth v purpoſely vnto death declaring ſith vnbeleeuers deſpiſers god plucked world violence behoueth v cōclude vnhappy pleaſures rich honour ſuch like thing haue deceitfull vanitie muſt buſie head therfore mā liueth ſuch ſort world knoweth himſelfe god hand ſo reſteth diſpoſeth himſelfe vpon goodneſſe therewithall readie remoue hence oft whenſoeuer god ſhall call aſſuring himſelf euerlaſting abiding place heauē cace may deemed happy mā regardeth god ne truſteth goodneſſe ne knoweth himſelfe keeping woulde fayne dwell euer worlde cannot bee gotten hence force conſtraynt although ſuch man haue wiſh time yet wretched creature better confirmation matter iob addeth god wyll beare wicked pray euen middes distreſſes deſerueth bee well marked iob ſheweth wherein cheefe weale wee haue wiſhe haue conſiſteth namely hauing recourſe vnto god mercifull v ſuccour v neede let v put cace man thing elſe coulde imagined yet wanted ſurely reſt nothing woorthe ſhoulde bee turned bane vvhat man laugh liue ioy pleaſure hee haue good ynough muche men honour ſhorte hee ſeeme petigod lowe paradiſe yet haue priuiledge reſorting vntoo god full beleefe reſorting ſhall bee vayne requeſtes ſhall bee graunted euer haue beſides ſhall bee curſe increace decay lette v marke well nought iob bringeth v heere principall poynt whole life reſpecte weale wee wiſhe god ſhoulde hand v ſhould reſort vnto ſhould heare v ſhoulde obteyne requeſtes ayded hand according neede knoweth conuenient welfare done onely wee looke vppon whole doctrine holy scripture wee ſhall ſee men alwayes vnhappie god looke vpon bee readie heare true conceyue ſo much reaſon greate dulneſſe ſurely one ſpark • good vnderſtanding none v ſhould perceyue doctrine totoo true let v open oure eye learne inioy happineſſe know wherevpon ſame chiefly grounded ſo wee may vnderſtande haue god ſo fauourable vnto v may reſort vnto aſſured truſt certaintie ready help v neede totoo wretched furthermore bee ſo good cace haue recourſe vnto god nother affliction miſerie hinder v beeing happie beholde remedie ought ſuffize oure miſeries god promiſeth ſtrengthen v vp good beaten downe deliuer v time conuenient yea turne miſeries welfare ſaluation ſo ſhall become many furtherance helpe v forward euerlaſting life wil make v perceiue ſent v thing conuenient behouefull v promiſes ſerue aſſwage ſorowes morouer euery one v may glorie according alſo paule ſpeaketh fifth romanes vnder peace hee maketh mention cōprehended iob ſpeaketh vve haue peace god except ſure loue ſo gate opē v haue acceſſe vnto vvhen wee haue ſayeth paule ſure fully perſwaded childrē god ſo may glory euerlaſting heritage hath promiſed v effecte iob ment ſaying god heare prayer wicked man yea though hee call vppon trouble heere may demaunded howe happeneth god refuſeth man calleth vpon ſeeing hath promiſed alwayes bee inclined ſuccour v yea tarry till intreated preuent ſute leaſtwiſe ſure ſoone open mouth god ready ſuccour v ſayeth prophet eſay howbeeit ſentence touched afore ſaide heare crie ſee threate cleane contrarie whiche although wicked haue theyr recourſe vnto god deſire haue pitie vpon thē yet hee heare ſolution verie eaſie wey well ſayd pſalme namely god neere vnto ſuch call vpon truth prophete ſheweth many ſeeke god howbeeit faynedly reaſon whereof bee conuinced none meane rid v miſeries god ſhould take v mercy pitiful v vnbeleeuers calvpō god without regard notwithſtanding haue mocked religion thing ſpoken v scripture cō cerning god prouidence mercie grace muſt looke hand therefore bee pinched aduerſitie cry ala god driueth therevnto euen mother wit hypocrite deſpizers god maye well haue ſome forme praying pray teethe outwarde theyr minde otherwiſe occupied oftentimes men may perceyue euen ſome harty affection bee forced yet truthe haue knowledge ſay god calleth allureth ſhal diſappoynted cōming seing pleaſure recken nūber child go vpon fooliſh raſhneſſe preſumption obedience voyce god truſting promiſſe hypocrite cannot ſpeake language therefore haue truth ſtandeth hand haue fayth faith depēdeth vpon god promiſes vngodly neuer taſted againe ought haue feeling miſeries ſo whē mā approcheth vnto god muſt abaſhed himſelfe muſt ſorie ſinnes muſt hate himſelfe muſte acknowledge himſelf exceeding wretched wicked hypocrite haue none although thē haue mouth open call vpon god yet vnhalowe holy name bicauſe right meening thē therfore fulfill prophet eſay ſayth nine twentith chapter whiche preace vnto god theyr mouth tung hart alwaies great way let v marke well lord ſayeth auoucheth heare ſuch call vpon meeneth prayer muſt proceede faith men muſte haue bethought well promiſes aforehād therby take boldneſſe come vnto yet therewithall muſt acknowledge themſelues wit forlorne damned deſtitute goodneſſe muſt throughly perſwaded ende may reſort fountaine goodneſſe grace thinke ſtrange though god put backe hypocrite wicked men whē come vntoo come willing mind pure affectiō would fayne ſhun god poſsible beit foraſmuch cannot ſhift thēſelues come compulſion comming therfore pray vnto god let v learne offer fre eharted ſacrifizes let v come willing minde aſſuring ourſelues without wee deſtitute wee haue neede perteyneth welfare furthermore lette v doubte fauoure mercie towards v ſeeing hath promiſed v let v alwaies beleeue euer ready receiue v deafe deſires come craue thē hand lo ſhall hearde god hande iob ſetteth downe purpoſely vvben trouble commeth vpon hypocrite bicauſe knowe feele howe auaylable prayer frute yeeld v true god ſheweth goodneſſe towardes v euery minute houre although perceyue yet doth preſerue v frō miſeries hang ouer heade putteth hande betwixt v cannot acquainted god grace time proſperitie knowe mainteyned ſame yet haue ſo certaine euident experience fauour help proſperitie aduerſitie forwhēſoeuer miſerie pincheth v death threatneth v haue wit diſcerne forlorne fordone god ſhould ſtep v reskue v good ſooth howe ſhould troubled wee conſideration ye ſee euident demonſtration god hath pitie vpon v ſo affliction thing wherein god ſheweth himſelfe cheefly ſauiour heere ye ſee ſayd pſalme thou ſhalt call vpon day thy trouble heare thee thou ſhalt glorifie therfore ſaid muſt ſeeke vnto god neceſsitie laſt caſte ſhould retchleſſe wee ſhould tarry till ſuch conſtraint came behooueth v call vpō god time ſhall ſhewed anone yet doth lord prouoke v ſcourging v ſo correcteth ſlouthfulneſſe quickeneth v vp come vnto expreſly ſayd time wherein muſte call vpon due conuenient ſeaſon according ſayd two thirtith pſalme rightuous ſhal ſeeke god due time ſay whē aduerſitie preſſeth haue occaſion ſo continually bycauſe haue occaſion time hereby warned whenſoeuer pinched vttermoſt ſo abide wee muſte faynte rather take courage come vnto god knowing allureth v worde mouth alſo doings hee onely reacheth v hand willeth v take alſo dooth drawe v force reaſon great ſluggiſhneſſe v lo haue mark ſtreine herewithall let v vnderſtand frute faith aduerſities wee right happy curſes god ſendeth vppon men ſinnes turned welfare meanes faith whē pray vnto god haue recourſe vnto mids trouble ſheweth himſelfe sauiour maketh v feele hee neere hande v iob hath ſayde ſo addeth vngodly delighte almightie ſeeke alwaies vnto vvhen ſayth wicked man ſeeke alwaies vnto god confirmation hath bene touched already witte muſt onely pray none otherwiſe alſo muſte ordinarily deede cannot paſſe one minute houre without god helpe ſurely fauoure looke hande conſiſteth onely deliuering death wee good pit brim alſo preſeruing v turning awaye euill v ſee life bee continually beſeeged hundred deathes miſeries wheretoo ſubiect without number god therefore muſte fayne garde v wall bulwarke according alſo ſayeth prophet eſay hee fortreſſe ſhielde ſo hee alſo named oftentimes pſalmes yee ſee ought call vpon god onely hee toucheth v ſmiteth hard ſtrokes vpon v euen wee eaſe reſt perceyue daunger towarde euen ſay behoueth v neuertheleſſe conſider many miſeries life ſubiect beeing perſwaded wee eſcape excepte god preſerue v may runne vnto ſay ala lorde keepe v thou vnder thy protection thy prouidence make v able paſſe ſo manye deathes hem v rounde muſte bee done euening morning moreouer know without going temptation aſſayle v dayly therefore pray vnto god muſt ſhoulde preſerue v daungers wherin concerning preſent life cheefe poynt ſhoulde reach hande deliuer v satan temptation ſuffer v fall euill according deadly downefalles whereinto may tumble euery minute houre wee hild vp power lette v marke neede faythfull haue bee ſo defended ſhielded god hande satan cannot ouercome v one ſide hee vndermineth v anewe behind hee aſſaulteth well one ſide well aboue beneath hath ſo many fyrie burning dartes hee woulde wounde v death god dooth defende preſerue v ynough v pray onely day neede ſelfe conſtrayneth v ſtandeth v hand continually make ordinarie exerciſe thus ye ſee ſayde wicked prayeth tymes vnto god yet one poynte ought marke well iobs intent v wit whereas wicked man doth nowe make countenaunce pray yet doeth continue minde proceedeth conſtantly one continuall rate heere ye ſee wherein prayer hypocrite differ prayer god child hypocrite withoute examining owne hearte welynough doo ſame thing god child outwarde ſight hee pray vnto god yea acknowledge hath neede ſo leaſt temptation world light vpon fretteth himſelfe meddleth calling vpon god grunteth agaynſt fometh vp ſuch rage ſheweth well nother depended vppon god truſted ſoughte rightmeening minde counterfetneſſe thus ye ſee hypocriſie faythleſſe diſcouered lorde handleth owne liking holdeth ſhut vp ſome diſtreſſe fret fume againſt cōtrariwiſe god ſcourge faithfull man hath prayed proſperitie time reſt ceaſſeth holde ſtill beſeeching playe ſurgion healing woundes hath made ſhort god child continue prayer haue ſayde perſeuerance holding ſo muche although god afflict ſeeme turne backe deafe requeſtes yet neuertheleſſe hold ſtill neuer giue ouer cleane contrariwiſe god graūt faithleſſe requeſt ſoone pray vnto pleaſure hee perfourme theyr deſires withoute delay thinke haue loſte tyme ſo ſee faſhion praying right firſt tarry till extremitie cōpell v rather aforehand neede ſhoulde praying god preuent v gracious goodneſſe take one point againe trouble diſtreſſe let v ceaſſe pray well proſperitie although god ſeeme fauour v rather aduerſarie enimie vnto v eſtimation oure fleſhly vnderſtanding yet behooueth v exerciſe faith calling vpon whereas may ſeeme v haue auayled awhit praying rather god deaf requeſts yet notwithſtāding let v hold ſtil leaue haue ſighed ſobbed day feele aſſwagemēt let v returne ſame remedie againe tomorrow good faith yee ſee although ſicke perſon perceiue phiſition hath done good firſte yet ceaſſe beleeue counſell ſtill meete ſhould put truſt mortall men god let v wey well ſaying ſet downe praying continually vnto god let v thinke purpoſe v go god ſtartes deſire haue mercie vppon v wee muſte doo diligently euery man ſtirre vp taske himſelfe euening morning ſaying vvhat wretched creature ſleepeſt thou heere knoweſt thou neede thou haſt thy god ſhoulde ayde thee againe bee afflicted ſuffer aduerſitie let v ceaſſe call vpon god nother let hart fayle v aſſuring ſelues affliction ſhall turne oure welfare ſoulehealth let v hold dayes lyfe yea let holding ſuch may importunate according lord ieſus chriſt ſhe weth v parable exhorteth v pray without ceaſsing although god ſhew effect firſt hee heareth v yet wicked man ſet delight god notable ſaying conteineth good leſſon heere iob putteth difference betwixte pleaſure ioy god child faithfull ſort haue pleaſure faithleſſe take hereby vnderſtand skorners god malicious perſons looce liuers although ſeme happieſt folke whole worlde vnhappie nothing wretchedneſſe contrarie parte although child god bee taken forlorne wretched damned creature yet right happy bycauſe ſet delight god thus ſee wee ſentence right worthy well marked called ten tymes rememberance none v hee deſireth haue ioye yet meane wee knowe true ioy wherein wee ought take wherevntoo wee ought referre cauſe ioy worlde curſed mouthe god owne ſonne ſayeth wo laughe vvill god haue v bee alwayes ſad god greeued offended ſhoulde make myrth purpoſe ſerue text ſayde god would fayne haue men merrie giueth wherwith merrie hee onely voutſafeth giue nurriſhmente ſuſtenance alſo giueth abundance wherwith merrie howe commes paſſe lorde ieſus chriſt curſeth laughter worlde bicauſe men beſotte themſelues mirth ioy cleane forgetting themſelues turning awaye god according wee ſee moſte men cannot bee merrie vnleſſe thruſte god good way runne ryot gyue themſelues ſuche ſuperfluitie remayneth wit reaſon ſomuche men ſo paſſe bound needes muſt mirth curſed bring example heereof needeleſſe woulde god thing ſo much knowen practized man v findeth ſame vice himſelfe bee talking god wee woulde fayne quickly end ſay ill v lord made v feele ſweeteneſſe finde hath taſted neuer haue fill talking god preferre minding muzing vpon god pleaſures worlde thoſe giuen vanity ſtand vpon thornes till bee gone ſpeaking god melancholike matter truely wee ſee bothe feaſting talking ſuch like thing trouble whole companie haue mention made god therefore let v thinke ſtraunge god pronoūceth horrible curſe agaynſte mirth worlde ſeeing ſo frowarde runneth quite oute ſquare right waye keepeth ſelfe within boundes bee merrie wantonneſſe diſorder let v come backe whiche ſayde lawe thou ſhalt bee merrie preſence thy god leſſon beeing merrie preſence god greate importance cannot bee doone without acknowledging good thing haue come hee giueth v intente wee ſhoulde take father yeelde thankes acknowledging bee fountayne goodneſſe wee ought ſticke vnto ſhort reioyce preſence god ſticke creature theſe corruptible thing knowe behoueth impute thing god fatherly goodneſſe receyue benefites whiche hee beſtoweth vppon confirmation loue fauoure thus yee ſee bee merrie reioyce preſence god contrariwiſe howe fare vnbeleeuers haue ſhewed alreadie cannot ſo muche laughe bee merrie muſte ſeparate themſelues god turne theyr backe vppon yea quite cleane forget ſuche manner mirth curſed ſo wee ſee nowe iobs meening iudgeth men happineſſe ought reſteth vpon thing ſeene hath ſo falne heathē men could skill ſay imaginatiue happineſſe like fayre picture looke vpō antike timber well guilded ouer gliſtereth maruelouſly within ſhalbe eaten mothes wormes euēſo al braue lad world laugh god ſport thēſelues withal may wel haue bothe credite rich pleaſure may thought haue happieſt life worlde meane wormeaten within wicked conſcience playeth hangman ceaſſeth torment ſo wote bee foraſmuch cannot call vpon god muſte needes bee without hope mercie withoute certaintie ſtay vpon alwayes feare bicauſe knowe howe long ſhall abyde plight bee ſhorte muſt needes blockes brute beaſtes contrarie parte yee ſhall ſee faithfull one merry euen inaduerſitie wee haue caſte eye vpon god behilde fatherly countenance towardes v onely ſaying comfort v wherein hee aſſureth v lay trouble vpon v ſhall bee able beare giue v good ende oure aduerſities wee ſhall haue indured paciently wee ſhall feele haue profited v oure ſaluation bycauſe expedient profitable v bee chaſtized hande father ende hee might drawe v away vanity world nowe ſee glaunced afore witte although ſaythleſſe haue thing men wont wiſhe yet vanitie leazing contrariwiſe although faithfull bee oppreſſed manie aduerſities yet ceaſſe bee right happie bicauſe call vppon god able reioyce forſomuche knowe themſelues bee fauoure hee chaſtizeth ſuch ſort turneth thing welfare heerewithall let v beare minde manner men ought merrie hath bin ſayde afore true lorde giueth v cauſe occaſion mirth haue breade eate wine drinke benefites neceſſarie life diuers ſortes liberalitie god beſtoweth vpon v hee gyueth man iſſue hee ſendeth good maketh proſper ſuch like thing beholde alwayes matter gladde ſort muſte wee bee glad euen preſence god haue alledged afore vvoulde bee merrie ſuche wiſe god ſhoulde bliſſe mirth like well might ſight lette v haue eye vnto god acknowledge ourſelues bee beholding good honoure furthermore lette v haue ſuche longing wee may learne beate oure braynes theſe preſent thing ſet heartes vpon aſſure ourſelues worlde paſſeth away wee ourſelues muſte paſſe away yea ryght ſwiftly therefore tye ourſelues go ſtill forwarde vnto god ende race iob addeth immediatly teach bande god almightie yea addeth freendes verie vnwittie ſith ſeene thoſe thing yet neuertheleſſe ſpeake ſo aukly according haue ſeene iob hath alreadye put ſufficient difference betwyxte god child vnbeleeuers ſhewing wee oughte deeme man life vnhappy outwarde ſhew appeereth day twayne little time muſte enter innermore ſearch harte yea muſt come hope death looke whither may lyue heere bee ioyned vnto god call vpon flee refuge yeelde themſelues wholly reioyce goodneſſe whither death able commit themſelues keeping betake ſoules beleeuing ſafe whē bee hande theſe happie contrariwiſe ſuch eſteemed honorable ſuche authoritie ſuche lyue delight pleaſure ſuche alwayes vnhappie bycauſe ſeparate themſelues god welſpring welfare come death truſte haled awaye force whereas ought put themſelues quietlye handes iob hathe ſufficiently diſtinguiſhed theſe thing already yet intent confirme matter better therefore vſeth preface ſhew hāde god almightie hee continueth ſtill ſame matter whiche hee dealt intende iudge rightly muſt reſt muſt paſſe beyond world fayth looke vpon god iudgementes another faſhion beholde thing wherein iobs counterparties deceyued iudged preſente ſtate would needes reſte vpon theſe inferiour thing iob therefore ſheweth behooueth v go hande god yea marke iudgements ſecrete ſhoulde ſay ſuche reſt onely vpon worlde caſt howe thing diſpoſed preſently ſhall alwaies haue vntoward miſordered iudgement lord calleth v telleth v althoughe hee execute iudgementes part diſcloſe v ſuche ſort may perceiue ſome incling yet doth reſerue many thing owne hand ſtill like prince diſcloſe minde publiſhe ſo muche proclamation hee knoweth bee expedient gouerning people alſo man owne priuate houſe ſay ſo muche ſhall good ordering houſholde keepe reſt himſelfe neceſſarie declared nowe mortall men take ſuch libertie ſhal god do▪ meete lord ſhoulde ſhewe v iuſtice wiſedome heere make ordinance knowen apparant v keepe nothing himſelfe vvhither goe nowe ſee iobs meening hee rebuketh froward pryde men needes incloſe god mightie power rightfulneſſe wiſedome within ſtate preſent worlde ſo might bee diſcerned contrary part ſayth iob hand god muſt looke vnto know ſhall know fayth motherwit ſhall neuer reach ſo high fayth wee may eſpye god reſerueth manye thing yea reſerueth thē ſuch wiſe behoueth v pacient whē ſee thing troubled turmoyled tarry till god make v beholde thing concealed v yet thus wee ſee doctrine haue gather ſtreine effect muſt ſo profite ſelues god woorkes worlde may able apply vſe example ſee god ſhew himſelfe mercifull one cace rigorouſe another let v learne truſt goodneſſe walke feare beeit ſuche regarde apparant workes wee may meane aſſure ourſelues reſerueth thing himſelfe whiche ſeene yet good men afflicted although haue theyr recourſe vnto yet hee ſeemeth minded help ſeene plaine meening ſort ſuch haue liued without man wrong troubled extremitie layde open ſpoyle god maketh countenance deliuering contrariwiſe wicked ſorte triumph harden themſelues theyr naughtineſſe bearing
