themſelues hande may miſuſe god without feare god winketh theſe thing neuertheleſſe let v greeued offended ſee thing ſuch diſorder god redreſſeth firſt puſh behoueth v call minde ſaide god hath many thing hand reſerueth himſelfe vvhy dooth ſo though know cauſe yet muſt humble ſelues wiſedome conſiſteth ſubmitting ourſelues good pleaſure god beit muche intendeth exerciſe fayth ſhoulde learne pacience experience let v refuze ſubmit whole vnderſtanding therevnto agayne ſeeyng god ſheweth v woorkes part let v ſo blinde ſee apparant neede make far ſearch get ſome taſt thing liſt looke vpon ynough teach v let v ſhut eye wilfully nother let v plonder away vanitie doo whome iob ſpeaketh vvhē god weakeneth v let v ſure minde ſhoulde ſo knowe work might yeeld due honour reſt vpon preſent thing fall concluding iudgemente whiche behooueth v hope thing ſhall bee brought righte courſe therefore let v vaniſh away vanitie ſay lette v turned drawne away worldely thing let v recouer ourſelues hope god ſetteth afore v whiche ieſus chriſte come gather v himſelfe wee ſhall ſee truſting god father vayne let v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente ſinnes praying humble v ſuch wiſe wee may haue recourſe vnto onely foraſmuche pleaſeth handle v ſo gently make v feele goodneſſe ſo many wayes ende wee might bee moued come vnto ſuffer v gad owne delightes luſtes hath brought v right way may neuer bee turned ſo may alwayes go forwarde till wee come heauenly heritage wherevnto hee calleth v ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe according truthe worthy lifte vp eye heauen preſent ſelues thee preſume ſo farre prayer ſhould c c sermon fourth vpon xxvij chapter 13 behold vvhat portion vvicked vvith god heritage extortioner receyue almightie 14 child multiplied ſhall put ſvvorde offpring ſhall bee ſatiſfied vvith breade 15 remnant ſhall buried deſtruction vvidovves ſhall vveepe 16 though heape vp ſiluer duſte gold clay 17 righteouſe ſhall cloth himſelfe vvith innocent ſhall deuide ſiluer 18 ſhall builde houſe moth vvatchman maketh lodge 19 vvhen rich man ſleepeth ſhall gather aught ſhall open eye nothing ſhal appeere ſhoulde ſeeme firſte bluſhe iob ſpeaketh another language done afore ſayes vnſaies agreeth counterparties neuertheleſſe haue ſeene already meening ſo ſhall take thing hee ſpeaketh heere yee ſee cauſe hath ſtriued thoſe came cōfort god doth alwaies puniſh mē ſuch wiſe world may throughly diſcerned ſeene eyeſight holdeth ſelfeſame opinion others haue hilde lette v marke iob place ſpeaketh owne meening putteth cace haue ſaide leaſtwiſe part ſurely ſhall ſee next chapter ouerthroweth theſe thing ſheweth breefly god iudgementes hidden v ſayde heretofore wee cannot comprehende compare gold ſiluer wiſedome although golde ſiluer likewiſe bee metall full droſſe hardly bee diſcerned value bee fyned although hard alſo find veines bicauſe hiddē earth yet mine gold ſiluer found wiſedome ſhe dwelleth men cannot find hir digging deepe downward climb ſo high vpward come hir vnleſſe god giue hir hereby iob meeneth hard poynt wiſedome v cōprehend god iudgements muſt make grounded rule though wee perfecte full knowledge world ſee effect iob contrary himſelfe ne condeſcendeth talke doctrine thoſe haue hitherto reſiſted rather declareth haue ſpoken partly true howbeeit altogither bicauſe god iudgementes executed ordinarily preſent life althoughe wee haue nowe ſome ſignes ſee iobs intent remaineth wee make oure profite doctrine vve haue two thing marke ſentence one contentes heereof declaration puniſhmentes god executeth vpon wicked witte liſteth puniſhe tranſitorie life wee haue marke god thinketh good deferreth thoſe puniſhmentes reſerueth ſuche wiſe bee ſeene preſent life yet muſt quiet though god aſleepe executed office knoweth wherefore hee delayeth reaſon vnknowen v yet pleaſeth ſo rule equitie righte thus yee ſee two poynts whervnto behoueth v bring backe conteined heere nowe touching firſte poynt let v marke haue ſay de already withoute cauſe god hathe threatned puniſhe wicked tranſgreſſors lawe ſuche faſhion ſhall euen haue theyr portion heritage heereby wee vnderſtande men ſcape vnpuniſhed heere belowe man taketh vengeance theyr miſdeedes outrage extortion haue committed god aboue miſſe therefore length ſhall come theyr account ſhall portion heritage although bee puniſhed firſte day yet god worke ende according haue declared already ſay wee muſte make generall rule yet ſhall fall ſo oftentymes lette v learne haue eye vnto god oure life let v thinke ſelues diſcharged bee eſcaped handes men nother let v flatter ourſelues therevpon though wee made fayre hande let v haue eye heritage god telleth v hee hath prepared ſuche haue liued amiſſe like ſonne heyre man ſhall poſſeſſe father good landes firſte day ſhall bee owner mayſter tyme ſo contrarie parte god puniſheth wicked ſorte incontinently haue offended yet theyr poſſeſsion kepte end ſhall reſerued certaynly heritage whereof cannot bee diſfeated marke one point ſaid child bee multiplied ſhall go ſworde ſpring ſhall bee ouerthrowen ſo ſhall bee buryed destruction without remedy theſe ſayings wee vnderſtand god puniſheth wicked deſpiſers maieſtie theyr owne perſones alſo extendeth ſame vengeance euen vntoo theyr child truely thinke ſtrange owne vnderſtanding hath bene declared already heretofore god may puniſhe child wicked without dooing wrong wee curſed adam bring nothing damnation v oure mother wombe god leaue v oure owne ſtate v great ſmall alreadie appoynted deſtruction god ſhould rend vp whole world plunge bottomeleſſe pit might accuſed crueltie gentle handling v commeth owne meere goodneſſe deſerte oures hee withdrawe grace ofſpring wicked puniſh father wrap child like deſtruction ſo ſomuch father hath run wickedneſſe child muſt faine fill vp iniquitie auneeſter haue puniſhmente caſt boſome scripture ſayth let v thinke ſtraunge god knoweth wherefore doth truely wee ſhould ſtande reaſoning owne imagination wee would thinke ſome reaſon ſhould ſo diueliſhe malapertnes meaſure god workes oure owne reaſon vnderſtanding herewithall let v beare mynde alſo hath beene declared witte mankynde fordoone damned ſelfe god may deale rigorouſly without blame ſaluation commeth ſelues god aſſureth v hee doth deſerte worthyneſſe owne meere mercie haue ſhewed afore ſo wee ſee god ought bee glorified rygour hee executeth vpon wicked puniſheth perſon child ſerueth caſte greater terroure vpon deſpiſers god bee threatned ſhall bee puniſhed euen ofſpring like contrarie part lorde ſayth hee gracious pitifull ſhewe mercie thouſande generation ſuch loue obey hee meeneth thereby aſſure v better infinite loue hee beareth v knowe god thinkes ynough loue v take v child voutſafeth alſo call child ſakes fauoure ſubſtantiall proofe ſingular goodneſſe haue wee ſo much cauſe reioyce god ſeeing hee onely receyueth v himſelfe alſo maketh oure child partaker ſame grace furthermore muche menne dull vpon ſpurre bowe eaſily god threatneth cauſeth ſay hath puniſhed owne perſons ſame rigoure muſt bee faine extend euen vnto poſteritie yea euen deceaſſe ceaſſe ſhewe ſore hated abhorred puniſhing ofſpring sith ſayd ſo needes ought wicked terribly afraid yea thoughe harder ſtone howe nowe may ſay howe great god vengeance bee vpon v ſeeing euen child ſhall bee wrapped fragmentes thereof ſhall flye poſteritie euen death oure iſſue muſte periſhe fault howe great terrible ſhall deſtruction thus yee ſee lorde doth expreſly threaten wicked puniſh euen child ende ſhould touched neerer quicke feare ſeeing men ſo dull hardharted owne nature let v come touched beginning witte god iuſtice may bee ſeene howe alwayes vve ſee child wicked doe ſoone melte away haue goodes thoſe wanze away ſeeme haue wherewith feede yea fat themſelues throughly men abaſhed ſee howe ſodainly waſteth away man tell howe ſeene ſo wee looke wiſely vpon god iudgementes wee may well ſee experience nought scripture ſayth god puniſhe wicked ofſpring looke vpon man ſhall haue endured great vnquietneſſe paynes lyfe long gather goodes deede hee heapeth vp greate hoorde ſhall ſeeme rich ſhall neuer fayle ſucceſſoures yet conſumed leſſe nothing whome cauſe may ſuche chaunge bee imputed let v conclude god putteth hande vvherefore let v bee blynded oure lorde worketh faſhion let v learne take warning example caried away couetouſneſſe ne imagine mannes welfare conſiſteth much gathering rather let v make account onely god bliſsing thing nouriſheth v continue nouriſhe child alſo god reach hand feede v ynough v let v praye continue ſtill ſuch wiſe wee may perceiue louing father aſſure ſelues fayle child deceaſſe much wicked doe take ſo great payne enriche themſelues rich heape vp ſhall occaſion caſt chlidren deeper deſtruction father thinke ſelues haue done maruellouſly well gathering much doe twine halter ſhall draw child deſtruction made learne ſome ſimple handicrafte might haue walked conſcionably ſame would haue beene good heritage leaue poſſeſsions become ſo blinde giue themſelues al naughtineſſe ſo rich muſte needes bee occaſion make abhorred god man god beare pryde men alſo prouoked againſt bycauſe vpon truſt rich take vpon doe euerie man wrong anoyance god therefore forced bende himſelfe againſt againe bee accuſtomed deyntie fare drunkenneſſe get oute cauſe make giue ſelues ouer euill ende nowe looke wickedneſſe increaſeth augmenteth ſo alſo muſt god vengeance growe hoter riper let v marke well wee ſee ſuch chaunges goodes whiche wickedly gotten father ſcattered waſted awaye handes child thereby god ſheweth v denouncing ſuche threates vayne marke one poynte yet therewithall let v marke alſo began ſay alreadie cō tinuall diuers time god taketh awaye goodes godly child ſo bee quyte ſtripped doth ſo euen ſome reaſon ſecrete himſelfe vnknowne v neuertheleſſe knowe ſame welfare meane hee intendeth inure pacience take awaye occaſion falling aſleepe heere bylowe elſe bee ſhorte hee mindeth miniſter ſome purgation let bloud bicauſe hee ſeeth well abundance poſſeſſe would bee noy ſome ſuperfluitie vvhen ſurgion letteth man bloud ſeemeth bee hurt verie deed ſelfeſame way whereby theefe murthereth man yet letting bloude phiſition curing diſeaſe good cauſe euen ſo happeneth oftentimes god bereeueth rightuous men goodes ſubſtaunce hee hath giuen elſe hee impoueriſheth child ſo ende wee ſhoulde take puniſhment cleane contrariwiſe haue ſayde purgation hee vſeth towardes child thereby alſo draweth backe intangled theſe worldly good leaſt ſame might occaſion bring ofſpring deſtruction ye ſee execution god iudgements haue ſpoken heretofore continuall therefore make general rule without exception let v come backe whiche wee haue ſpoken ſo often alreadie ſhall bee declared nexte chapter following god iudgementes alwayes viſible ſo wee might poynte ſay god dealeth alwayes manner ſo euer god puniſheth man perſon ofſpring let v looke well vpon ſuch example may profit ſelues winke others puniſh firſt let v tarie paciently till day lorde appeere ſo long world bee night reaſon thinges ſo darke comming lorde ieſus chriſte bookes regiſters ſhall layd open nothing ſhall hidden therefore let v tarie paciently daye furthermore god ſcourage v yea euen ſuche wiſe wee may ſuppoſe hee hateth v perſecuteth v mortall enemie yet let v therefore ceaſſe humble oure ſelues vnder acknowledge ſame bee meane whereby hee would drawe v vnto let v ſuffer handle v thinketh good determining ſelues bee wedded muche owne fanſie thing euerie man life owne hande ſo hee might ſay haue thing bee thus thing ſo vvhere obedience againe let v conſider wiſdome v couet thing good v nay rather cleane contrariwiſe tempted wiſhe thing ſerueth vtter vndoing thus ye ſee cauſe haue bridle ſelues put ſelues wholly good pleaſure good god nowe followeth wicked man ſhall haue heaped vp golde dust treaſure apparell houſhold ſtuffe ſuche thing alſo lande rightuouſe ſhall cloth himſelfe maye come paſſe manye time often happeneth wee muſt bee blinde ſo wee ſhould diſcerne hande god fare better ſayde man may well turmoyle ſelfe hee maye riſe earely goe late bed yet ſhall neuer forward rather backward except god bliſſe contrariwiſe giueth faythfull one ſo euer meete euen lye ſleepe lo threate lo heere promiſſe vve ſee nought ſayde ſo hee make faithfull proſper ſometimes hee aduaunce ſuch wiſe good ſhal grow betweene handes againe wee ſee number whiche neuer leaue gathering life long yet god ouerthroweth vpon ſodein ſo muche haue taken great paine ſlippeth awaye vvee ſee bee ſo doe wee ſee alwayes let v learne looke vpon god temporall iudgementes ſuche ſorte wee conſtreyne doe tymes alike great difference betwixte thinges concerne preſent life ſecrete iudgementes god ſame manner muſte wee iudge promiſes promiſes belong preſent life ſee thoſe promiſes performed alwayes one rate god knoweth bee expedient v touching ſpirituall promiſes belong welfare ſoules certeine behoueth v conclude god neuer diſappoynte v let v put difference betweene thinges concerne tranſitorie life thing concern heauenly life euerlaſting kingdome god preſente life wee maye generally well looke god ſhoulde guide v hope long myndeth keepe v heere wee ſhall nouriſhed goodneſſe continue alwayes vnder ſhadowe ſheelding wee particularly determine hee giue v aboundance goodes hee graunt v health hee deliuer v oure enemy help v meanes vve precizely point vpon thing behoueth v haue oure eye ſeeled vp god haue v heere battell done fall vpon feete ſay trouble worlde ſhall let god leading v ſaluation hee hath promiſed v wherevnto calleth v like ſaid puniſhments curſe god euermore vpon wicked certaine although bee riche although triumphe althoughe bee credite eſtimation yet able call vpon god therefore haue reſt conſciences continually diſquieted nother aſſuage greefe knowledge god goodneſſe haue droppe ſuch knowledge declared yeſterday although god execute vengeance vpon wicked open ſight world yet ceaſſe curſed middes proſperitie laſte puniſhment daye doome miſſe muſte needes come though tarrie neuer ſo long yea haue liued long time ſuche wiſe god may ſeeme haue bene fauorable willing followe lure thing ſame farre woorſe bene chaſtized world muſt bee fayne pay deere ſhot goodes haue crammed vp world ſotting ſelues ryottouſneſſe abuſing gentleneſſe pacience mocking doctrine religion laſt puniſhment whiche god denounceth againſte wicked miſſe yet world may welynough fall ſhall puniſhed firſt daſhe leaſtwiſe perceyue nowe let v come iob ſayeth wicked ſayth hee ſhall heape vp money duſt god ſhewe vengeance better ſuffereth wicked enrich themſelues ſuche ſort ſeeme seagulfes ſwallow vp good world certeſſe wicked man ſhould neuer proſper men ſhould perceiue puniſhmente ſpoken heere namely growne rich hath gathered much yet afterwarde enioy man ſhould aske thoſe take ſuche paine heape vp ryches intent ſay tell may befall ſhall growe olde ſhall haue neede ſuccour many ouerthwartes befall men haue wherewith help ſelf need beſides haue child leaue poore lo aunſwere take ſo much paine enrich ſelues yea meane ſeaſon whither reaſon reſtreine themſelues diuers ſo nigardly greeueth themſelues good dare helpe ſelues owne want whither fal god ſnatcheth good hand nowe happeneth hath ſuffered haue full ſcope ſtrippeth quite end cleane one moment ſeene ofſping become poore man tell howe wee ſee inioy thing haue heaped togither ſo ſee threatning executed vpō many namely wicked ſhall heape vp golde ſiluer moueables yet ende good men ſhall come bee clothed true bycauſe god child walke ſimply playnly may want many thyngs may ſeeme pouertie threatneth attache within daye twaine yet god prouideth ſuch wiſe alwayes kepe way ſtill vvee ſee godly ſhall ſometymes bee clothed ſpoyle wicked yet thing make certaine rule bynde god continually vvherefore behoueth v beare alwayes mynd god iudgements euer apparant viſible bee ſeene men eye vvhen ſee wicked man rich ſtumble ſaying meeneth wee ſee wicked deſpyzers god honoured ſeemeth v god gouerneth worlde thinges guided fortune behold faith vtterly defaced go meaſure god iudgementes thinges wee preſently ſee oure eye therefore let v learne ſuſpende oure iudgementes verely god plucke wicked mennes goodes hand let v vnderſtand fulfilleth threat whiche wee heare ſpoken place hee doe let v marke hee reſerueth execution iuſtice vntill laſt day bring thing perfection nowe bycauſe nouriſhe hope ſtill haue v wedded world ſeeke felicitie heere bylowe paradiſe pleaſure lift vp eye aloft paſſe lightly worlde iourney knowing oure ſelues bee wayfarer wanderer worlde therefore behoueth v trauell continually heauenly euerlaſting heritage muche mente followeth wicked man ſhall buylde houſe moth ſhall hee watchman caban euen ſuche watchman caban watcheth vyneyardes vvhen vnbeleeuers deſpizers god doe buyld beare themſelues hand ſhall dwel thouſand yeares death doth ſtatelineſſe ſeene building made deſpizers god ſhewe imagine immortalitie world beare themſelues hand ſhall prolong life palace vvhen man hath builded houſe continue thouſande yeares beleeues houſe tyed ſhall meanes renoumed god ſcorneth ſuch ouerwening cauſe iob compareth houſes wicked men houſes mothes howe ſo moth marreth waſteth thing make himſelfe lodging eateth cloth eateth furre eateth findeth ſhorte ſo euer moth lodgeth alwayes another body coſt hinderance yet notwithſtanding nothing corcuption vermine lodging vvhen vinekeeper maketh caban watch vineyardes three monthes ſone vinetage done go caban although man ſet hande yet falleth downe ſelfe euen ſo ſayd wicked men make ſtately houſes beare ſelues hand whē haue buylded maner ſhall dwell euer vvhat themſelues euen moth ſay haue nothing corruption muſt ſayne carrie continually seing ſo ſurely houſes continue long true ſhall make great ſhewe time ende god beate downe houſes ſo ſhall abyde long thus ſee yee notable iudgement god executeth vpō thoſe make ſuch eſtimation thē ſelues world much ſee example thereof wee ought marke well thereby learne neſtle ſelues world build guile wrong extortion let building according good god hath giuen v let ſuch well houſed beſot ſelues owne luſtes neſtle themſelues let men neſtle themſelues vpon earth much liſt yet ſhall barre god plucking away let v kepe ſelues well making neſt bylowe according bee ſayde nine twentith chapter iob made reckning ſtate ſhould neuer change men beguile ſelues behighting ſelues ſuche euerlaſtingneſſe god alſo laugheth fonde preſumption ſcorne therefore godly lodged owne minde yet let count ſelues ſtraungers worlde let alwayes readie part hence whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god haue commodity bee wiſhed yet let goe warde ſtill learne knowe god aduertizeth eyeſight place muſt abyde behoueth paſſe thus ye ſee haue remember perceiue lorde haue men ſet mindes vpon thinges bylow therfore let v trauell right way hee calleth v ſhall wee bee bliſſed ſhall euerie v dwell reſt time hath liue bycauſe ſhall bee troubled vnquietneſſe wicked deſpizers god haue thus much concerning poynt furthermore although ſelues alſo houſes bee nothing corruption yet haue promiſe comfort v wee bee reſtored fully heauenly glorie ſhall haue need theſe materiall building bylowe yea bodie itſelfe ſhall bee another manner thing nowe yet therwithall let v learn alſo build ſnatching catching leude dealing cauſe oure lorde doth ſo deſtory great palace builded throwe quite downe according alſo wee ſee prophet threaten ſhalbe dwelling place ſhreeke oules wylde beaſts bird pray yea nightcrowes wylde woodwardes lorde doth auenge ſelfe robbery extortion committed buylding great place according ſayde prophete abacucke ſuche haue bereft men good doe build quire betweene walles ſo one wall ſhall crie oute builded vpon bloud another murther therefore let faythfull aduiſe ſelues well builde bee vppon goodes wrongfully gotten mynde haue ioy dwelling therewithall ſo euer worlde goe let reſt make neſt let readie remoue ſo euer ſhall pleaſe god nowe furthermore ſayde wicked man ſhall die bee buried honourably hee ſhall open eye ſee nothing ſerueth conclude matter hath bene treated iob meeneth maye well come paſſe ſo doeth indeede wicked ſhall ſtumble yea euen hee hath bene aduaunced thing whereat looketh lorde exalteth wicked afterwarde letteth fall yea euen deadly fall touching death buried honorably agayne looke finde ſuccoure diſappoynted longing heere haue faire looking glaſſe god iudgementes howebeit play thoſe held argument againſt iob wit wee goe inforce god ſet thing perfecte ſtate ſhall bee done till laſt day yet meane ſeaſon behoueth v bee warned looke vpon god hande ofte lord ouerthroweth wicked beateth vvee muſt poynte ſeeke chaunce child world whiche imagin wheele fortune menne hoyſed vp alofte afterwarde let fall agayne chaunges returnings ſee world thing happen aduenture behoueth vp father vppon hand god howe sometimes hee puniſheth haue abuſed grace ſometimes hee beareth ſo perceyued hee myndeth puniſhe yet ſhall haue ſo much terrible account make haue touched alreadie notwithſtanding wee ſee wicked fall behoueth v knowe god aduaunce without cauſe ſame ende fall ſhoulde greeuouſer euen breake necke beene hoyſed vp aloft god muſt make fall faſhion furthermore nought buriall ſpoken heere although bee neyther heere reſpecte ſaluation yet two thing conſidered one wicked doe death defye god nature thinke prolong greateneſſe pompouſneſſe ſtill ſpyte nature oure lorde conueyeth rottenneſſe yea euen ſay wordly fleſhely men make muche brauerie life afore ſumptuouſe buriall ſaue memoriall periſhing men might ſpeake euer ſee fooliſh curioſitie worldling vnbeleeuers vſe beeing buried great pompe continue pride deſpite god god laugheth ſuch preſumption ſcorne hee diſappoynteth expectation ſo much whereas purpoſed buried honorably diuers time hath giuen cleane contrarie buriall marke one point yet alſo conſidered buriall brought god inuention man without good grounde god ordinance end ſhould witneſſe vnto v reſurrection euerlaſting life vvhen men buried layde vp earth ſtore houſe vntill maye bee rayſed vp agayne laſt day ſo buriall vnto v looking glaſſe reſurrection therefore wicked diſappoynted buriall much oure lorde vttered curſſe vpon viſible manner yea euen well deathe life according ſayde heere yet notwithſtanding lette v marke wicked bee buried honourably wee muſte bee troubled thinke god hathe forgotten hym ſelfe hee executeth iudgementes conuenient time wee ſee scripture ſayeth riche man namely buried ſayeth lazarus mention made buriall ſo much known whether eaten dogges whether caſt abroade feeldes scripture ſpeaketh ſpeaketh buriall riche man contrariwiſe god child happen ſometimes lye vnburied concluded therfore accurſed like wicked buryed bee ſayd bleſſed death ſhewe v god executeth temporall puniſhmentes one egall rate worlde reſerueth chiefe himſelfe till latter day much ſayd wee ſee good men burned put open ſhame god child periſhe wicked yea touching bodie ſo bee caried gallowes although bee martyr ieſus chriſt ſlaunder bee honour god preſerments world yet withſtanding god gyueth burīall howe commeth paſſe howe falleth threatnings againſt wicked ſpoken behoueth v come backe haue ſayde namely ſuche iudgementes hidden incomprehenſible yet behoueth v tarie till lorde bring v daye wherein thing ſhall bee diſcouered meane ſeaſon let v knowe heauen ſhall ſerue tumbe ſuche ſo martyred meane innocent put reproche wicked perſecuters honorableſt buriall worlde nothing compariſon benefite priuiledge god giueth man finde honourable tumbe heauen oure lorde maketh ſerue tumbe child bereaueth common ordinarie buriall ſo pleaſe god haue v buried let v know ſame record goodneſſe hee bereeue wicked buriall let v alſo behold vengeance life death yet notwithſtanding let v learne refraine ſelues haue eye cloſed vp reſpect ſecrete iudgemenres vntill become vnto laſt day hee ſhewe v thing perfectly order nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele wee may bee ſorie ſuch wiſe may deſire nothing bee gouerned holie ſpirite therewithall let v beſeech humblie vouchſafe vſe infinite mercie towards v releaſing offence whereby bound iudgement may ſo paſſe world may wedded worldly thing ſtabliſhed fayth hope vntill lorde haue called v kingdome ſhall fully ſee thing know ſmall portion meane wee may bee ſtrengthened againſt ſtumbling blockes worlde neuer ceaſſe giue glorie oure god notwithſtanding ourfleſhly reaſon comprehend huge depthes workes maye pleaſe graunt grace v c cj sermon fift vpon xxvij chapter firſt vpon xxviij chapter 19 vvhen rich man ſleepeth hee ſhall gather ought hee ſhall open eye nothing ſhall ſeene 20 trouble ſhall come vpon vvater tempeſt ſhall carie avvay night 21 eaſt vvinde ſhall beare avvay hee ſhall gone ſhall hurle place like avvhirle vvind 22 ſhall ruſh vpon ſpare ſhall flee hande 23 men ſhall clappe handes togither againſt hiſſe place xxviij chapter siluer hath ſpring golde hath place grovve 2 iron taken earth braſſe molten ſtone 3 god hath ſet ende vnto darkneſſe vnto thing tende vnto end bound darkneſſe ſhadovve death 4 ouerflovveth riuer againſt inhabiter vvaters forgotten foote vvhen haue riſen aboue man ſinke againe 5 one ſelfe ſame earth commeth breade vnder chaunge vvere fire 6 place vvhere ſtones saphyres moulde golde 7 birde hath knovvne vvay neither hath eye kyte ſeene 8 lion vvhelpes haue vvalked neyther hath lion paſſed 9 layeth hand vpon rocke turneth vp mountaynes rootes according yeſterdayes talke ſaid heere riche man ſhall open eye finde nothing vvhereby ment rich men ſhall ſafe time thinke ſhall neuer want thing end ſhall bee hidden ſhall bee hope ſhall awake ſeeke ſuccoure fynde ſumme although riche men ſleepe wealth time bycauſe thinke ſhall neuer wante haue eye blynded ouerweening yet notwithſtanding god doth afterwarde inforce ſeeke helpe without fynding perceyue truſting rich vayne ſo confounded iudgement god dayly ſeene therefore wee bee warned althoughe god giue v wee wiſhe ſo wee thinke wee ſhall neuer want wee muſt fall aſleepe knowing life ſubiect ſo many chaunges woulde wonder ſee therefore let v watch calling vpon god let v watch wee reſt vpon thing haue owne handes let v watch knowe haue neede ſuccored many way meane let v learne returne vnto god ſettle ground ſelues vpon prouidence goodneſſe warning wee ought gather ſentence ſeene alwayes therefore ſayde let v learne make general rule although rich men ouerflow welth haue great trayne euery man laboreth doe ſeruice finally want nothing let v thinke god hath giuen ouer office hee reſerueth ſelfe iudgemente executeth vpon ſome ende wee ſhoulde thinke hee able accompliſhe worlde pleaſed men take ſentence ſomewhat otherwiſe wit referre ſaying bee ſhall open eye looke rich men men ſo meening ſhould men ſhall looke thoſe folke become liued wealth bare ſo great port worlde ſee according ſayde ſeuen thirtie pſalme ſawe perking vp hie ceder mount lybanus hee touched clowdes heade anon came backe founde place yee ſee howe god maketh wicked vaniſhe away ſuch wiſe remembrance wyped world ſenſe agree well text furthermore otherſome vnderſtande ſentence neither death buriall expounded yeſterday though ſayde wicked man layeth downe reſt ſhall finde none yet notwithſtanding eaſieſt interpretation ſaye wicked ſhall ſcape god ſhewe iuſtice vpon haue ſayde commeth paſſe howebeit alwayes muſt euer ſeeke execution god iuſtice worlde euill principle would trouble v haue declared afore ſaw theſe thing eye wee haue imagined vpon let v vnderſtande lorde delayeth iudgementes hee thinketh good maketh manifeſt world nowe conſequently ſayde fearefulneſſe ſhall ouertake wicked man rage water ſpeaketh water hee meeneth ſodaine ſtorme tē peſt whirle winde commeth night iudgement god cōmon ſo alſo notable wit god ſendeth ſuche fearefulneſſe vpon wicked know become ſame cō meth ſtorme tempeſt night whiche man foreſawe ne yet tooke heede ſpoken purpoſely bycauſe wicked doe beare ſelues hande god ought let alone reſt yet notwithſtanding though troubled throughly quiet bicauſe haue euill conſcience yet behight ſelues wonder ſayde prophet ſpecially eſay make couenant death ſo thinke ſelues ſuch league attonement graue although earth couered floude vtterly drowned yet miſcheefe could come neere yee ſee howe wicked puffed vp pryde god pincheth harden thē ſelues thereby ſurely man threaten tell ſhall ende attemptes ſo litle moued therwith 〈…〉 mock thus ye ſee ſayd fearefulneſſe ſhall come vpon rage water according alſo ſaying saincte paule theſſalonians ſhal ſay peace ſafe ſhall ſodainly ouerthrowne deſtruction thought doubted ſhall come vpon talke ſuche alteration god ſendeth vpon wicked deſtroieth ſodenly ſent ſtorme tempeſt night let v learne ſo ſotted fooliſhe preſumption thinke god let v alone reſt neyther let v flatter oure ſelues rather let v knowe lorde intendeth keepe v vnder lowlyneſſe ende wee ſhould haue myndes freer come vnto bee drawne awaye vanity worlde rather bee prouoked giue ſelues wholly vnto yee ſee howe behoueth v ſeeke peace god worldly goodes wee doe ſo let v bee afrayde wee ſhould bee ouerthrowne ſodayne tempeſt god ſende ſuch fearefulneſſe vpon v ſhall trouble v contrariwiſe ſuche preſume vpon earthly proſperitie muſt bee fayne feele hande god although world yet world come muſt faine come account thē eſcape hand heauenly iudge vvherfore let v walke aduiſedly furthermore though wicked nowe without feare let v thinke god hath forgotten wickedneſſe wee doe alwayes perceiue iudgements preſently haue ſayde therefore behooueth v tarie diſcouerie vntyll laſt daye aſſuring oure ſelues god ſometymes trie oure faythe holding hande hidden v behoueth v note althoughe feare whiche god ſendeth vpon wicked vppon deſpyzers woorde bee perceyued heere yet notwithſtanding feele ſecrete feare continually heartes ſayde prophete eſay peace wicked lyke waues beate one againſt long anye violent winde wee ſee water ſo turmoyled waues breake one agaynſt euen ſo wycked withoute trouble men handes doe torment themſelues hangman ſelues thoughtes affection ſhall quake falling leafe bodie foloweth fearefulneſſe ſhal bee ſecrete outwardly ſet good countenaunce vpon matter alſo knowe ſelues dulled ſelues chafe god admit warning giueth moue repentance therefore let v learne ſeeke peace haue ſpoken whiche haue good pure conſcience▪ ſo wee leane vnto god call vpon although ſend v trouble yet ſhall ſo vtterly ouerthrowne ſhall haue whereof reioyce goodneſſe ſayde finally ſhal caried away eaſt winde driuen place ouer whelmed miſeries ſhall flee away theſe ſimilitudes eaſtwinde vvhirlewinds added one purpoſe reſpecte countrey iewrie eaſterne winde boyſtouſeſt holie scripture ſheweth ſo ment wicked haue proſpered become rich mightie ſhall neuertheleſſe caught away thrown roſe great tempeſt came ſodainly ſuche winde ſhoulde beare downe thing ſo ſhould compelled flee awaye whereas thought thēſelues wel fenced yea truſted alſo thervnto ſhall wel fele al reſtrein execution god iuſtice vpon although ſcare poore menne bee terrour euery man yet muſt bee fayne runne away themſelues ſhall bee power withſtand inconuenience ſhall well knowe muſt needes bee vtterly ouerthrowne bycauſe hande god perſecuteth puniſheth bee ſhorte ſhewed v heere ſuche bee ſo bolde troubling others ſhall ſo daunted hand god ſhall forget ſtoutneſſe lionlyke courage pryde ſhall become cowardely curres ſhall feele god hande deſpyzed afore heereby wee bee warned foreſee god iudgementes along aforehande wee maye wayte paciently althoughe god let v alone reſt yet let v ceaſſe examine ſinnes acknowledge oureſelues worthie bee beaten hys roddes ſo let v caſte downe oure heades learne bridle ſelues bee ſo bolde doe amiſſe let boldneſſe calling vpon god deſpiſing ſinne diuell world power vnder protection god yet therewithall let v walke alwayes lowlineſſe modeſtie knowing ſuche haue ſorte beene terroure vntoo others ſhall bee conſtreyned hyde ſelues ſhall finde ſafetie according certaine wicked ſhall bee forced flee needes muſte thing bee fulfilled whiche ſayde pſalme lorde ſhall become maye ſcape thy handes ſhoulde flye aboue clowdes thy maieſtie aboue ſtoppe mee get mee ouer sea thy hande ouertake mee goe downe deepes thou arte well able fetche mee backe againe wicked maye deſire mountaynes fall vppon ſhall boote hande god ſhall take holde ſo euer hyde themſelues vvherefore let v aſſure ſelues wrong boxe ſeeke peace bee perſecuted hande god may well ſhunne eſcape nowe although bee ſeene matter preſently yet doeth god ceaſſe iudge worlde ſtill poynte wherevnto wee muſt continually haue recourſe finally ſayde concluſion euery man ſhall clappe handes hee ſeeth wicked faſhion euerie man ſhall hiſſe way ſcorne mockeris place ſay poore folke beene oppreſſed afore durſt ſhewe ſelues abroad ſtreats bycauſe theſe robber fleeced readie eate vp ſhall reioyce lorde doth manner deſtroye ſuch beene credite authoritie ſo much ſhall clappe hand mocke pryde ouerweening ſuch deſpizers god heere might demaunded whether bee lawfull good faythfull bee glad ſee fall wicked ſuperfluous queſtion place bycauſe tolde v lawfull ſo doe barely ſhewed v worlde glad according alſo ſeene experience pillers pollers haue moleſted menne well great ſmall die beaten downe hand god thing men reioyce haue bene enemy worlde yet wee muſte marke caueat reioyſing fleſhly ne proceeded deſire reuenge good holie allowable god wee bee prouoked reioyce aduengement fleſhly affection oure gladneſſe curſed condemned ſo men moued paſsions whether gladneſſe ſorrowe ſurely ioy ſorrowe commonly ſinfull vvherefore man reioyce fal wicked muſt doe vpon fleſhly deſire onely allowing god iuſtice agreeing hee ſheweth yet meane hee muſt alwayes bee eſtabliſhed grounded feare loue alſo haue good gouernment owne affection thus ſee may bee lawfull v reioyce deſtruction wicked let v take good heed wee bee ſtirred therevnto fleſhly affection ne intermeddle thing owne yet notwithſtanding touching preſent texte let v marke howe ſhewed v heere wicked whiche full ambition vayneglorie ſeeke haue eſtimation whole world muſt needes become lothſome god bring ſo hatred euerie man ſhall reioyce deſtruction yee ſee ſhall bee diſappoynted expectation althoughe happen time yet let v think lorde hath therefore forgotten duetie let v tarie reuelation whiche promiſed v laſte daye heere yee ſee iob declareth many ſecretes nature ſeene worlde therevppon concludeth man vnderſtanding thinges hidden yet notwithſtanding goddes wiſedome ſurmounteth farre hygher take though ſayde thinges chaunge worlde wee ſee continuance order nature fruitefull feeldes haue beene haue borne good corne menne ſee fire ſaye barreynneſſe man woulde haue thought hadde beene grauell ſande oftentimes hath beene golde precious ſtones vve ſee many chaunges world ſayd hundred ſeuenth pſalme matter whiche prophete treateth ſhewing reaſon men ſinnes earth becommeth barreine ſo muche ſeemeth men haue ſowne ſalte place well inhabited become deſerte ſo men conſtreyned eſchue famine heate colde greeue ſuche wiſe wote become alſo god goodneſſe ouergoing naughtineſſe man maketh feeldes frutefull barreine maketh ſtore ſuſtenance grewe one graine corne opinion iob meant heere make ſuch deſcription conteyned ſayde pſalme haue alreadie ſhewed meening wit many thing worlde ſecrete wherein ſeemeth reaſon yet notwithſtanding men ſhall finde reaſon laſt alſo finde thing hidden god wiſedome men ſhall neuer attaine reach ſo high compariſon holdeth ſmalleſt greateſt iob ſhoulde ſay go freendes verie hard thing man vnderſtanding ſeeke meanes howe finde golde ſiluer precious ſtones true men neuertheleſſe bring paſſe yet may well called ſecret nature alſo ther thing wherin men grauelled wonder ſomtimes ryuers runne ſome place none euer thought bee according water ſometimes riſe ſometimes fall ſo man maye ſometimes goe place drie foote anon water ſhall ſwell vp hys chinne one brokes ſhall drie another increaſe verely ſeemeth bee great ſecrete brokes increaſe melting ſnow great raine ſhall ſometimes ſee ſprings dried vp anon guſh water ſo abundantly man ſay god mindeth ſhewe power ſuch chaunges theſe therfore thing ſeene worlde ſerue preſent life yet darke yet true man reaſon may wel inquire ſtudie vpon ſo hee ſhall finde ſome reaſon god wiſedome maner thing vvhen come iudgementes let v thinke conteine brayne compaſſe wit let v reuerence thing knowe confeſsing maieſtie god ouer hie v becommeth v goe abace ſuche wiſe imagine determine thinke good let v content ourſelues god ſheweth v aſſuring ſelues ouerlong diſtance betwene god v muſt bee fayne come vnto v elſe wee ſhall neuer come vnto howe comming v hys meening ſhall yet knowe thing wil ſhewe v laſt day thus yee ſee iobs meening notwithſtanding neceſſarie nowe ſtande vpon thing ſpoken heere intent holie ghoſt ſhewe v cunning ſuch mynes would verie ſmall profit ſhould beſtow three foure sermon teach ſeeke mynes gold ſiluer thing haue ſeeke euery man would occupie himſelf trade muſt ſtand vpō euery peece wee finde mention made mynes gold ſiluer ſayd vnto v gold grain mettall found ſand ſome ryuer ought ſuffiſe v ſee god hath put ſuch ſecrets nature ende magnified v thus ye ſee effecte haue beare mynde ought acknowldge god infinite power wiſdome yea euen leaſt thing world muche ought ſecretes ſo ſtrange v golde ſiluer ſuch like thing ought moued mynds ought tobe better wakened may better perceyue vnderſtande ineſtimable power god oure lord haue v dullardes like block wood would haue v behold workes hand indeede good reaſon wee ſhould knowe thinke vpon yea euen ſuch wiſe may yeeld due glorie moued thereby know worker ſo become like vnhappie wretch walke worlde treading god workes vnder feete knowing maieſtie therefore let v bee ſo brutiſhe leaſtwiſe although ſo heauie groſſe conſider god maieſtie power common baſe thing yet whē come thing ſtrāge v let v moued caſe begin conſider god worketh wonderful mean otherwiſe vnthankefulneſſe wil vnexcuſable thinke vpon therwithal let v mark god wil haue mynds tied thing world leuer ſhuld come vnto ſhould know profit ourſelues warning giueth v vveſe principal poynt haue marke ſtrein meete god high excellent work ſhuld ſet mynds vpon thē conſider wel conſidering ſhuld alſo glorifie god ſayd expreſly god hath bounded darkeneſſe yee ſee howe darkneſſe hideth thing day time men may diſcerne white blacke aſunder night commeth beholde thing defaced oure ſenſes fayle v diſcerne man ſtone wee diſcerne houſe hill yet darkeneſſe whiche bereeueth menne ſorte ſyght diſcerning bounded god ſetteth ſtinte ende heereby iob meeneth althoughe bee greate diuerſitie thinges worlde yea euen vnto verie darkeneſſe hydeth awaye ſyght thing yet notwithſtanding menne go anon god ſendeth light darkeneſſe continueth euer heere wee haue good verie profitable leſſon whiche man reaſon may haue ſome abilitie vnderſtande iudge theſe lower thinges whiche concerne preſent tranſitorie life concerning thing heauenly belong kingdome god concerning iudgement thoſe thing hidden v ſayd doctrine profitable yea verely well vnderſtood ought truely many euen ſmalleſt loweſt thing cannot conceyue except god giue v abilitie according wee ſee howe many ſimple idiotes men terme know brute beaſtes manner folke ſet god oure eye looking glaſſes humble v withall vvhen ſee ſtarke idiot hath wit reaſon behoueth v looke well vpon mirrour nature vvhence come reaſon vnderſtanding haue ſingular gifte god let thoſe haue reaſon vnderſtā ding know god hath indued wyth ſuch grace therefore bound vnto marke one point ſurely whereas lord hath made ſome ſharp witted others giuen handſomneſſe compaſſe thynges vndertake ſo forecaſt conclude bring matter paſſe wiſely compaſſe many thing ſhort time otherſome ſo ſlowe dull witted man muſt fayne beate head beetle learne thing ſuch diuerſitie among men ſheweth euidently haue power iudge diſcerne aright ſpeciall gift god muſt fathered vpon nature ſo ſhould acknowledge lord dealeth euery man according himſelf thinketh good lo haue marke furthermore ſayeth man wit nature able conceyue thinges heere beneath whiche concerne preſente life word nature barreth god gift ſerueth v vnderſtand thing gyuen vnbeleeuers alſo thoſe whome god hathe forgotten holy ghoſt named ſpirit adoption bycauſe hee marke god imprinteth vpon child although haue holy ghoſt regenerated haue earneſt pennie pledge hoped ſaluation yet may wee well haue vnderſtanding common thing beleeuers vnbeleeuers iudge thing heere beneath yea oftentimes wicked deſpiſers god ſharper witted skilfuller doings according alſo lord ieſus chriſt ſpeaketh thē ye ſee muſt beare minde may well ſort comprehend thing heere beneath haue ſame abilitie god haue ſayd afore neyther men haue like meaſure god diſtributeth euery man thinketh good yet notwithſtāding god putteth men intoo worlde without giuing ſome portion reaſon ſo may bee able iudge theſe inferior thing moreouer alſo diſcerne betweene good euill vvhere ſhall wee finde ſo beaſtly men wil condemne robberie murther whoredome nature teacheth v ſo againe men haue ſome lawes forme common weale ſee well cannot breake order guyde well matter perteyne preſent life mā furthermore haue alſo trade handicraftes one baker another plowman another shoomaker another clothyer theſe trade gift god common well vnbeleeuers faithfull whome god hathe inlightned holy ſpirit howbeit ſuch giftes ſerue men bycauſe mankynde coulde bee maynteyned ſtate without ſuche helpes meanes yee ſee effect thyng whiche wee haue remember although great number ſecrets nature thing high belong preſent life yet hath god giuen men abilitie attaine vntoo example ſpeake ſome handycraft man come cunning occupation ſhall finde ſtraunge thing yea ſome woorkes require ſuch cunning yee woulde woonder poſſible done men ſay howe coulde men know gold lyeth earth beholde men make salt water howe commeth paſſe surely euen bycauſe god hath giuen men skill agayne golde siluer ſpoken heere beholde mettall mingled earthe hath ſo much colour yea ſeemeth vtterly vnprofitable howe man diſcerne howe fine ſo ſhould ſerue turne become precious metall meane traffike betweene man man according wee ſee gold ſiluer applyed vſe might done agayne touching artes handicraft ſo bace common firſt men ſeeke worke specially ſee men ſowe corne growe ſome ſay men make wine ſuch thing vvhen know theſe thing wee thinke ſtraunge yet god hathe giuen v skill otherwiſe ſhould ſeeke thing meane ſome capacitie men comprehend natural thing notwithſtanding darke firſt enterance although men harde groſſe vnderſtanding yet attaine caſt earthly life bicauſe god giueth aydes meanes wherewith paſſe world commeth mounting aboue tranſitorie life finde v come ſhort heere ye ſee wherein proude folkes misbehaue themſelues beare themſelues hande bycauſe bee ſharpe witted ſuttle theſe lower thing able alſo iudge god ſecretes whole doctrine law prophetes goſpell god maketh thē double blind ſo preſumptuous fayth ſpirituall light inſight god iudgements groweth v neither haue wee reſpect kind haue giuen v aboue god good pleaſure ouer beſides order nature yea ſee god puniſheth pride ſuche truſt owne wiſedome theſe baſe inferioure thyngs beholde theſe luſtie worldling come fineneſſe ſuttelties find hart mocke god world yea ſo polytike theyr owne ſeeming nothing ſhall eſcape therevppon deuiſe wonder vndertake enterpriſes aboue abilitie god ſuffereth runne head faſhion meane whyle ſo blyndeth neede little child laugh ſcorne oftentimes commeth paſſe craftieſt ſuch take themſelues peerleſſe policie deſtitute reaſon put ſoyle according scripture ſayeth god catcheth wiſe owne wilineſſe pitfall vve ſee poſsible man ſo well aduiſed ſhould ſo ouertaken dazeled ſo ſmall matter hath wit verely though god heauen blind ſuch thynke themſelues ſee cleerely truſt owne skyll wiſedome ſtandeth hande puniſhe ſuche pride inaſmuch preſume vppon themſelues rob god honour muſt fayne reuenge himſelfe ſuch trayterouſneſſe agayn forſomuch men apply wittes naughtineſſe rather goodneſſe behoueth lorde alſo puniſh miſuſing giftes hath beſtowed vpon ſingular gift god giueth v good ſharpe vnderſtāding turne ſame craft naughtineſſe reaſon god ſhould puniſh v defile thing appoynted onely owne welfare alſo common benefit neighbour god puniſh ſuch pride men truſt much owne wit theſe bace tranſitorie thing pray muſte hee needes cut theyr combes plunge intoo bottome hell reuenge himſelfe theyr pride ſtatelyneſſe ſo loſtie would faine mount vp heauen priuie heauenly ſecretes knowe thing god hath reſerued himſelf ought belong alone let v learne although wit ſerue v well ynough diſcerne thing concerne belong heere earthly life yet ſayd able mount vp heauen enter god ſecret determination conuey thing wit braine lord hideth himſelfe bee ſhort let v aſſure ſelues thing concerne euerlaſting life farre aboue reach lord muſt faine worke v yea euen ſupernaturally onely inlighten v manner men alſo giue v newe light whiche hidden v bycauſe proceedeth ſayd ſpirit adoption haue ſpoken furthermore▪ ſith ſo let v conſider man free mad bee mainteine themſelues wee haue free guide ſelues godward attaine euerlaſting life would follow neceſsitie firſt wee ſhoulde haue faythe rightuouſneſſe holineſſe wee ſee scripture condemneth v blind wretch telleth v wee muſt aduaunce ſelues ſo high thynke attaine god ſecretes muſt confeſſe ſelues deſtitute wit reaſon thus ye ſee firſt leſſon muſt learne come god ſchoole become fooles sainct paule ſayeth truly ſeemeth ſtraunge v yet muſte paſſe way ſo intend taught god hand ſhould play ſchoolemayſter towards v muſt become fooles ſaye wee muſt acknowledge ſo much one drop reaſon vnderſtanding v deſtitute brute beaſtes haue leſſe skill diſcretion v haue therfore let v learne humble ourſelues end god may reach v hande sith cace ſtandeth ſo muſt wee doo nowe firſte let v vnderſtande comprehende god ſecretes hee muſte bee faine giue v holy ſpirite inlighten oure darkeneſſe forſomuch wee bee ſo farre ſeeke hee muſt ſhewe v v knowe muſt preſume haue knowledge giueth v marke one poynt wee muſt alſo conſider haue receyued heauenly light gift vnderſtanding commeth holy ghoſte muſt alſo come holy ſcripture take vpon v ſearch god woorkes iudgements conteyned let v content ſelues wyth knowledge god ſheweth teacheth v let v haue mildneſſe ſay well lorde whenſoeuer thou telleſt v thou wilt haue v knowe let v receyue quietly thou goeſt let mind ſtay alſo two thing therefore haue marke owne behoofe doctrine firſt thruſt foorth ſelues fond preſumption know permitted v pray god gouerne v behalfe inlighten v holy ſpirit ſecondly hold ſelues word ſuffer ſelues taught ſame coueting know nothing whiche conteyned according alſo oure lorde ſheweth v whatſoeuer meete neceſſary welfare nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying hym make v feele better wee haue done beholding iudgements may always prouoked walke feare wee haue profited ſounde vnderſtanding may pleaſe hym make v go forwarde ſo wee maye hereafter wrapped vtter deſtruction whyche prepared wicked hardened ſtubborne againſt correcting vice wee may preuent iudgement obteyne grace mercy hath afflicted v world may giue v reſt hee hath promiſed thoſe whyche witte deliuered miſeries whyche wee haue indure worlde wee may bee gathered vp heauenly glory made partaker hys goodes reformed hys image true perfection may pleaſe hym graunt grace v alſo people nation earth c cij sermon ſecond vpon xxviij chapter 10 cutteth riuers rockes eye ſeeth euery precious thing 11 bindeth riuers ouerflovv bringeth light thing hidden 12 vvhere vviſedome found vvhere place vnderſtanding 13 man knovveth value neither found land liuing 14 depth ſayeth ſea ſayth vvith 15 fine gold ſhall giuen neyther ſhall siluer bee vveyed exchaunge 16 ſhall bee valued vvith vvedge golde vvith precious onix vvith saphyre 17 gold chriſtall ſhall match neyther ſhall exchaunged plate fine gold 18 ſhall mention bee made corall gabiſh vviſdome vvorth pearles 19 topas aethyop ſhall made equall vvith hir neyther ſhall ſhe bee pryzed vvith vvedge cleane gold 20 vvhence commeth vviſedome vvhere place vnderſtanding 21 hid eye liue yea hid foules ayre 22 deſtruction death ſay vve haue heard renoume hir vvith ear 23 god knovveth vvay vviſedome tell vvhere hir place 24 beholdeth endes vvorlde ſeeth vnder heauen 25 hath vveyed vvindes meaſured vvaters 26 vvhich hath ſet lavv vpon rayne appoynted vvay roring tempeſtes 27 ſee knovve diſpozed ordeyned 28 hath ſayd vnto man feare lord vviſdome eſchue euil vnderſtanding ihaue declared alreadye iobs intent meeneth worde vviſdome intent ſhew men farre ouerſeene comprehende god ſecrets ignorant nothing wee may knowe word vviſedome meeneth hee taketh knowledge thing ſpecially thoſe god concealeth v till hee giue v full diſcouerie thing dealeth v meaſure according knoweth profite haue ſayd iob ſheweth heere many ſecrete darke thing nature yet men attaine thē yea wee ſee ſome reaſon ſo farre foorth oure lord granteth v poynt muſt always come backe furthermore let v marke well ſame meaſure therewithal let v vnderſtand oure reaſon vnderſtanding extend thing heere bylowe whiche concerne preſent life would mount vp kingdome heauen ſeeke thing perteyne euerlaſting life wee fayle vtterly blind ſo ye ſee demanded heere wiſedome ſhall found bee found ſayth among men aliue dead true many may take vpon bee wiſe alſo bragge carie wiſedome ſelues yet god holdeth couert euen departed althoughe bee wrapped mortall fleſhe ſotted worlde doo notwithſtanding comprehend thing ſecrete purpoſe god may well go heere ſeeke aboue beneath wee ſhall neuer come wiſedome diligence man god holdeth owne hand againe man intend purchaſe rich beguileth himſelfe men may beare thēſelues hand well become rich owne trauell become wiſe power yee ſee wiſedome ſo excellente treaſure man cannot find equall thing exchange let man heape vp gold siluer let gather togither al precious ſtones ſhal match ſee effect iobs meening heere humble v end wee ſhould thinke ſelues able comprehend god ſecretes rather ſhoulde willingly bee ignorant thing paſſe capacitie furthermore wee intende knowe meete v lette v deſire god ſhewe v hys holy ſpirite poynt muſt come way alſo let v come concluſion ſet downe heere god hath wiſedome himſelfe hee hathe well ſhewed creation worlde hee ordeyned counterpeyſing windes water therefore lyke onely god hath wiſedome hymſelfe welſpring thereof alſo hath ordeyned men wiſe fearing ſeruing hym vve ſee iobs concluſion wiſedome men bee inquiſitiue knowe thinges throughe fonde curioſitie keepe themſelues within bound knowe behoueth ſerue god ſubmit themſelues vntoo true wiſedome muſte men holde themſelues brideled ſtay thus much concerning letter ſentence nowe lette v conſider howe wee may profite ſelues firſte let v marke well hee ſayeth wiſedome bee founde among liuing alwayes admoniſhe men may truſt theyr owne reaſon attribute ſo ſharpe ſuttle witte themſelues comprehende reaſon god woorkes admoniſhment needefull conſidering pride v wee bee ſo prowde preſumptuous naturall thynges muche doo wee ouerſhoote ſelues thyngs ſo euery one v taketh himſelfe bee ſo wittie nothing maye eſcape contend ſhall beare bell amongſt v ſhall wiſer fellowes fight againſt god whiche horrible thing yet wee bee ſo mad proofe whereof men truſted much owne wit ſhould haue ſo much ado bring world order great ſmall mount vp intoo ſuche preſumption yeeld themſelues plyable vntoo god ſuffer themſelues gouerned ſpecially god intendeth teach v vnskilfulleſt yea ſay verieſt idiot v carp againſt bicauſe euery man taketh himſelfe wiſe ſaying tuſhe know gouerne ſelfe trow take beaſt behold god doth v honour ſhew v hys wyll yet notwithſtanding wee cannot abide hee ſhould teach v seeing men cannot abide god ſhould bee maſter teacher muſt needes worſe mad whereof commeth thys ſaid ouerwening would v ſeeme wiſe therefore ſayde admoniſhment worthy borne well mind bee practized euery man conſidering wee haue vice rooted v nature ſo would fayne haue god let v alone owne fancie medle teachyng v bycauſe thinke ſelues ſufficient abilitie ſelues therfore let v mark well whereas ſayd heere wiſedome found among men iob rather holy ghoſt iobs mouth meeneth heere effect beate downe loftineſſe v wee imagine ſelues haue ſo good ſo ſharp vnderſtanding cō prehend thing heere holy ghoſt auoucheth men beguile themſelues vaunting ſorte want wiſedome wiſedome wiſedome know god ſecrets hath bin ſaide wee may well haue ſome vnderſtanding thing heere beneath although darke yet god diſcouereth v knowledge called naturall bycauſe ſee men partaker thereof althoughe egall meaſure cace concerneth knowing god iudgements man reaſon muſt needes dazeled ſo muche men thinke aduaunce themſelues ſo muche muſt beaten downe confounded marke one poynt iob ſayth expreſly wiſedome purchaſed gold siluer precious ſtones bereue men vaine preſumption man rich thinketh himſelfe huge meruaylous man vtterly forgetteth himſelfe bycauſe eſteemed men ſo iob ſheweth whatſoeuer excellencie v therefore wiſer neyther muſt ground ſelues therevppon needeth wee ſee wretched world beguiled rich men men great eſtate authoritie whē ſpeake thing saying vvee may reply againſt beholde ſuch one ſayd men forepoſſeſſed ſuche eſtimation diſcerne bee rich man hath ſpoken although bee beaſt yet men ſo dazeled authoritie amazed adayes hindreth ſo many ſimple folke come vnto god truth frame themſelues thereafter bycauſe looke vpō great one world ſaying behold gouerne behold rich men behold noble men none receyue doctrine therefore token nothing worth doubtfull v meddle withall vve ſee riche men put ballance ſo men thinke wiſedome tyed god wote cleane contrary yee ſhall often ſee riche men ſo blinded vaine preſumption rich bryng nothing follie rocke men aſleepe make men vtterly brutiſh much ſayde greate eſtate dignitie man meane ſmal degree wil know himſelfe gather wittes lord gyueth diſcretion contrariwiſe highly aduanced forgetteth himſelfe blinded lyke hee ſpreadeth vvings imagining himſelfe bee ſo lord ſuffereth reaſon vaniſh away become idoll vvee ſee thys eye wee conſider wherefore lette v weigh well ſayd heere witte wiſedome purchaſed gold siluer leaſt men ſhould truſt much thing whiche may attayne heere beneath let v aſſure ſelues vnderſtand god ſecretes ſpeciall gift treaſure ſhette vp v till god owne meere goodneſſe come inlighten v giue v therof ſeemeth good heerewithall let v marke well concluſion iob ſayeth heere god hath ſeene dispoſed wiſedome creation world afterward hath ſayde man beholde ſhall become wiſe ſay fearing heere iob compareth god v bicauſe vnpoſsible abate tame pride otherwiſe force meane bringing v god men may well ynoughe ſhew v infirmitie rudeneſſe oure wit yet euer draw backe neuer come poynte ceaſſe keepe ſtill ſome pride ſecrete althoughe conuinced wit ſo weake pitie ſee yet notwithſtanding giue ouer thys fooliſh opinion haue wiſe brought vnto god wee driuen knowe nothing wee muſt deceiue ſelues owne ſelfeweening see iob ſetteth god v heere end wee ſhould know wyſedome alone hee ſetteth creation world eye vvell ſayeth men ſo ſharpe witted comprehend god ſecrets diſpoſeth order nature hath weyed windes water thing true haue ſayd philoſophers haue well conceyued reaſon thing ſeene world men come creation ſo woonderfull thing muſt needes abaſhed reuerence infinite wiſedome god confeſſe themſelues vnable comprehend thus ye ſee iobs meening ſentence thervpon ſheweth v muſt throughly beleeue oure wiſedome conſiſteth ſearching examining ſeeking thing knowing profitable v according god ordinance behold heere excellent ſentence one ſayd god ſecretes knowne none himſelfe body counſell ſayd text scripture therefore muſt preſume enter ſecret determination know lawfull v muſt learne onely pleaſeth ſhewe v hys ſchoole aſſure ſelues wiſedome cauſe ſayde excellent ſentence two vice mē hard correct one ouerboldneſſe fooliſh vanitie touching ouerboldneſſe men deſirous knowe god hath appoynted ſhort would wiſe whether god would whereas god onely fountaine wiſedome thus yee ſee outrageous vice yet notwithſtanding hard correct ſee men proceede furious outrage ſay know whatſoeuer come yea god permitteth ſetteth barre waye gate ſhut againſt thee way wilt thou enter go yet mēbe inquiſitiue lawfull whatſoeuer come furthermore thinke attayne therevntoo owne power yea bragge alwayes owne reaſon wit ſtandeth v hand fight againſt boldneſſe pride nature learne able nothing becommeth v know lorde haue v marke one poynt ſecond vice ſayd fond vanitie whiche men doo leaue thing profite whervpon ought reſt whervnto ought apply whole ſtudy making none account meane fall tormenting themſelues vayne thing nothing profite traueling diſcourſing would know ſay wouldeſt thou know liketh beholde wee bee led wyth fond deſire know thing nother oure profite edifie v eyther fayth feare god cauſe lorde concealeth many thing v firſt intendeth humble v knoweth pride would intollerable wee knewe thing ſeeing notwithſtanding ignorance yet men ſee hold v would ſeeme otherwiſe lo god abaceth v deſire bee wiſeſt become ſo fonde euen little child may mocke v althoughe lord hold v ſo awe yet ceaſe wee bragge ſtill beare ſelues hand yea perſwade men alſo wiſedome v doth god keepe v ignorant thing whiche hidden v bycauſe enuieth v hee meeneth learne v humbleneſſe thereby principall poynt wiſedome modeſt ſober yea feele owne infirmitie wee exalte ſelues yee ſee god hideth many thing v ende wee ſhoulde learne bee lowly whych thyng wee would nothyng vnknowen v agayne diſcerneth good v thing wherein intendeth occupie v hold v wholy wee finde scripture lord mynded feede curioſitie let v know would deſire eares alwayes itching tickling deſires would fayne knowe theſe fond thing doo good god redreſſe vanitie fooliſh longing v ſheweth v onely thoſe thing oure behoofe ſo let v remember well thys ſentence ſayde god diſpoſeth wiſdome yea keepeth himſelfe yet notwithſtandyng hath ſayd vnto men feare ſhall wiſe heereby iob meeneth firſte men beguyle themſelues ſo deſirous breake neckes flie ſo hie aſmuch would flye without wing let learne content themſelues whyche ſhall pleaſe god open vnto marke one poynt ſecond poynt let v acquaint ourſelues well whiche god ſheweth v wherein hee haue euery one v exerciſe himſelfe wee muſt knowe ſuche thinges may edifie v feare haue v wiſe bee heauengazers flitter ayre know wee ought liue matche oure wiſedome knowledge rule life becommeth v ſee firſt muſt let god al one ſecret iudgemēts preſume know thing aboue v content ſelues diſcerne thinges god ſheweth v knowing many thing reſerued latter day time ſhall ſee thing fully perfectly muſt ſuffiſe v knowe thing part whiche lord vouchſafeth diſtribute vnto v thys ſhewed v heere ſay muſt couet know aught god ſecret iudgements meening wee muſt deſire paſſe beyond whiche oure lorde teacheth v word wee knowe god guide v wee neede afrayde ſhall erre wee fall gazing owne fancie thinges god hath hidden v wee enter bottomleſſe depth reaſon ſhould ouerwhelmed lo howe god puniſheth pride many men cannot bee cōtented knowledge thing meete thē ſo iob correct two vice ſpake ſheweth v god hath ſpoken thys vnto men ſaying god hath ſpoken vnto men great weyght one ſhould ſay god intended cut men occaſion ſearching ſecrets determination forth ſheweth therewithal declareth doctrine wil haue men learne ſchoole profitable edifie holy lyfe might learne ſubmit themſelues vnto created formed walke hys obedience thus ye ſee wiſedome god hath ordeyned v ſhorte iob ſetting feare god v whole wiſedome meeneth lord plucketh v backe whiche haue moſte mind vnto vaine ſpeculations ſerue v purpoſe puffe v vp fooliſhe vaineglory haue ſaid windie knowledge make v preſume ouer far yet hath profit inſtruction iob hath ſet thoſe two thing one againſt another one one ſide ſaying men wiſe muſt make themſelues wiſe manner god beholde god hath perfection wiſedome neerer wee preace vnto ſhall confounded v make ſelues like vnto god wiſedome rather ſubmit ſelues vnto lo wiſedome vvee ſee happened oure father adam mother eue god ſo niggardly indue ſuch wiſdome knew good ye ſee adam formed image god haue vnderſtanding thinges pertayned ſuch wiſe hee could wiſhe thing modeſt well ruled deſire satan blowed eare ſhould like vnto god knowing al thing therevpon ouerſhot himſelf playd horſe broken looſe thinking wyth himſelfe ô ſhall ignorant nothing vve ſee howe caught poynt whereof commeth beaſtlineſſe wee haue thys day man ſpeake v god needes muſt ſpight teeth know wretched beaſts delight ſuppoſe ſelues haue darkeneſſe scripture alſo ſayth vvhereof commeth ſenſe mā comprehendeth nothyng god miſteries god call v one ſide wee ſhrinke backe ſide elſe ſo lazie cannot fynde hart come hym wherof commeth payment adam pride contented bee ſo farre foorth inlightned knowledge thing god ſpirite expedient welfare would needes become like vnto god ſo lifted vp coulde meete god mightie hande caſt downe horrible gulfe confuſion wherin day ye ſee iob ſayeth expreſly god ſayd vnto men hee ſhould ſay go aduiſe ſelues well way take become wyſe bee deſirous mount aboue clowdes ſearch many thing ought vnknowne vnto v ſay dyd god delay creating worlde ſo long hath moued wherfore diſpoſeth thing ſort ſuffereth thing paſſe manner wiſedome conſiſteth thoſe thinges ſhall thinke ſelues wiſe maner ſhall go aſtray ye ſhall neuer bee able gette maze ſhall ſhrinke aſide ſuch wiſe ſhall ſhamed euer vvhere finde wiſedome belongeth ſayeth god diſcerne determine good learne contented tel teach charge ſee behoofe feare honour therefore hold paſſe boundes wee ſee meening iob rather holy ghoſt ſo let v learne gyue heede oure fooliſhe tickling luſt know thing ſtand v ſteade enter god ſecrete determination purpoſe ſearche reaſon iudgementes thing wherein muſt occupie ſelues wherevpon muſt ſet mindes vvherevppon vpon ſuche thing may ſerue true edifying paule meeneth ſaying holy scripture profitable god hath ſayde vnto men wiſdome feare hym ſayde alſo ſhewed deede hee publiſhed hys lawe expounded firſt prophet laſtly goſpell yee ſee god ſheweth v wiſedome feare make doctrine profitable let v note firſte goodneſſe god maketh v partaker wiſdome knoweth bee good expediente v notwithſtanding wee bee bereft ſhet nature hath bin ſayd already wiſedome found nother amongſt liuing amōgſt dead man may go deepe tarrie euer confounded without finding wiſedome god dead may ſay wee haue heard ſpeaking know nother haue familiaritie behold lord doth v honour grace offer v thys wiſedome ſecret ineſtimable treaſure vve haue acceſſe ſelues god offereth v ſuch ſort neede make long circuites finding let v ſuffer ſelues taught god treaſure ſhall put handes ſingular benefite god hee vouchſaueth communicate thing vnto v ſo vnacquaynted vtterly depriued baniſhed heere ye ſee vpbraydeth men vnthankfulneſſe eyght chapter prouerbs hee ſayeth wiſedome crieth ſtreetes open place come yee ready ſhewe ſelfe knocketh gate ſhe declareth hir deſire dwell among men yet man receyueth hir men mocke hir make none account ſo great benefite offered ye ſee blame god vpbraydeth v withall wee may well knowe wiſedome ſuche precious thing nother gold ſiluer may comparable therfore muſt needes ſay bee worſe ſtraught diuell hath betwitched v make none accounte ſayd wiſdome ſeeing ſhe offereth hir ſelfe vnto v needes greate ſeeking ranſacking hir needes great paynes taking farregoing neede receyue hir ſhe ſet afore v yet ſee man make account hir vvhy ſo weight pinne ſay occupy head ther one v al ſo wedded owne ſelfe profite ſet gayne pennie ſhilling wee wiſedome god agayne one thing letteth v according euery man giuen one vice ſo hee eaſly turned aſide drawne away god whorehunter bee ſo weltred filthineſſe eares ſhall ſtopped yea vtterly deafe ſo ſpeaking god may crie alowde vnto heare aught couetous perſone doth like drunkard much ſhort ſee let many turne mē aſide ſuffering themſelues taught god yet al vice god findeth fault withall text salomon ouercommon ordinarie wit ſendeth treaſure wiſedome whiche ought common men knocking gate bidding feaſt euery man doth rather ſhrinke away thā draw neerer furthermore god place accuſeth condemneth men beaſtly careleſneſſe vnthankfulneſſe ſo ſheweth faithfull greatly ought eſteeme bee taught according ſayde fourth deuteronomie behold thy wiſedome vnderſtanding haue thy god come vnto thee ſhew thee good thine inſtruction edifie thee lo wherevnto lord calleth v hee intendeth bring v himſelfe ſhewing v true wiſedome vnderſtanding hearken vnto namely conceyuing ſheweth v worde hee ſhould ſay ye wretched ſoules deceyue ſelues ſetting mind vppon vaine thing worldling vnbeleeuers hold ye tell aſſuring ſelues true wiſedome vnderſtanding fooles yea mad men ye attempt ſtep thoſe boundes therewithall vpbraydeth new agayne vpbrayding ſheweth wee vtterly without excuſe walke aright ſeeing haue woorde say ſayeth thirtith deuteronomie ſhall climbe vp intoo heauen ſhall go downe deepe ſhall paſſe ouer sea beholde woorde thy heart thy mouth lord declareth cannot alledge ouerhard v conceyue thing aboue v wee alledge dulneſſe vnderſtanding highneſſe ſecretes heauen ſayeth god haue prouided haue made way aforehande giuing lawe ſhewing wyll haue ſo raught wiſedome ſame would fayne dwell among according alſo ſayde eight prouerbes delight dwell among men ye ſhall neede therefore make long iourneyes come vnto ye neede ſtie aboue clowdes ye neede go downe deepes nother neede yee go ouer sea woord giuen mouthes put harte behold wiſedome thing muſt reſt vppon nowe firſt ſeeing caſe ſtandeth ſo men deſpize grace god offered communicating hys worde vnto make warre againſt aſmuch lieth therefore let v take good heede ſelues ſee heere ſaying ought wey greatly v ſayd wiſedome delighteth dwell among v god place bringeth hys owne wiſedome ſendeth v hys owne perſone ſeeing delighteth god wee ſhould receyue wiſedome let v aſſure ſelues refuſing make warre againſt haue ſayde one would ſpite ſet purpoſe driue quite cleane away v ouerheynous thing furthermore whereas deſire owne welfare god ready ſhewe v way calleth v end ſhould finde fulneſſe welfare vouchſaue come runne backes vpon teacheth v end ſhould know tranſformed wee know image glory preferred thing therefore whō cannot abide taught aſmuch would turne light darkneſſe deface god glory might ſeene knowne muſt men needes bee become terrible monſters diuelles incarnate labour ſo aboliſh god glory quench light euen light theyr whole welfare ſoule health ioy yet vice ouercō mon let v learne eſteeme benefite god doth v vouchſaueth call v hys ſchoole openeth v dore end wee ſhoulde learne wheras nature bereft ſaid wiſdome commeth ſet oure eye offereth v familiarly yea tarieth till ſeeke knocketh dores calleth vpon v deſiring nothing winne v himſelf seeing lord vſeth ſuch gentleneſſe towards v allure v ſo curteouſly let v learne make account honour let v ſo vnkind whē would haue v come vnto ſpecially let v remember hath bene ſayd namely owne nature requiſite god ſhould teach v angelles heauen touching angells heauen although noble excellent nature although bee parttakers already heauenly glory although hold ſtil ſoundneſſe creation yet notwythſtanding exceedingly bound vnto god pleaſeth make priuie needes muſt rapt aſtoniſhment grace hee hath giuē cace ſtandeth v firſt reſpect body bee earthly creature althoughe god hathe giuen v immortall ſoules yet dwell heere houſes mire clay hath bin declared heeretofore nothing corruption v wee heere brute beaſtes woormes thing ſo baſe heauie ther ſeemeth infinite diſtance betweene v heauen yet worſe thing berefte vnderſtanding giuen father adam therefore forlorne creature vvhereas aſſes ox keepe ſtill owne nature men ſo corrupted marred god calleth ſteade loue ſuch goodneſſe leſſe moued brute beaſtes beholde god deſireth earneſtly wee ſhould partaker glory yea good thing ſhould enter aforehand poſſeſsion woorde preached vnto v wee profite ſelues theſe thing pray matter therfore ſeeing time ſuffer ſpeake nowe let v aduiſe ſelues firſte ignorant god haue v onely knoweth meete conuenient v therefore let ſuffize v bee taught ſchoole learne thing ſheweth v ſecondly let v learne know ſuche wiſe conteyned holy scripture therewithall let v ſo thankleſſe reiect benefit hee mindeth beſtow vpon v offereth vnto v let v attētiue indeuour put away euill affection ſuffer ſelues ſo taught god may edified thing ſheweth v profite deſirous bee ſtabliſhed tyme life nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying hym make v feele better may returne vntoo true repentance acknowledge miſeries wherewith wee bee fraught hee may voutſafe clenſe v bring v fully backe vnto reforme frowarde nature ſeeing wee helde darkneſſe ignorance ſo nothing blindneſſe v may pleaſe hym ſo inlighten v hys holy ſpirite wee may deſpiſe worldly vanity keepe way heauēly life whervnto calleth v furthermore wee may haue modeſtie keepe v word couet know thinketh good edifying whyle wee heere hys ſchoole may profite vntill hauing taken v frō earthly pilgrimage gather v kingdome gyue v full perfect fruition thing whiche wee knowe portion meaſure according capacitie doth beare may pleaſe grant grace v alſo people nation c ciij sermon third vpon xxviij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon former text haue told already iobs intent ſhewe menne ought hold themſelues ſuch ſobrietie couet know god permitteth thē alſo muſte runne gadding aſtray folow way poynted cauſe iob ſetteth difference betweene god v ſheweth reaſon mortall man ſhoulde preſume ſeeke thing god contented ignorant nothyng let v contented ſubiect vnto whome cannot atteyne furtherfoorth pleaſeth lifte v vp himſelfe ſpecially ſo gracious vntoo v abace himſelfe end ſhoulde know hym impoſsible infirmitie mount vp highneſſe god therefore muſt fayne come downe vnto v ſo let v thinke oure wiſedome know al thing let v vnderſtand behoueth v farre lower degree vnder highneſſe god worſhip whiche hidden v witte wonderfull ſecrets god ye ſee effect wee haue marke vppon texte ſayd god creating worlde hath well ſhewed another wiſedome attayne vnto oure power meaſure wind water diſpoſe whole order world nature ſeeing theſe thing ſurmount capacitie let v learne humble ſelues contented vnderſtanding giuen v according whiche hath bin declared already let v wey well ſaying god hath ſayd man ſerueth ſhew lawfull v know giuen v aboue furthermore let v mark well grace god graunteth v aboue creature iob ſayeth expreſly god turned himſelfe vnto men giue ſome wiſedome meaſure therein ſheweth like brute beaſtes liue without diſcretion god hath gyuen v excellent priuiledge ſhould haue vnderſtāding ſome light reaſon know liue ſo wee might haue ſome modeſtie honeſtie v therefore let v learne eſteeme grace god honour hath pleaſed v ſeparating v ſort brute beaſtes well worthy noted bycauſe wee ſee two extreme vice men reaſon whereof neuer keepe good meaſure would fayne wiſe full vnderſtanding giue themſelues many vayne curioſities gaze trudge vp downe vnſaciable deſirous knowe neuer reſt bycauſe labour alwayes vaine vnprofitable thing behold heere euill extremitie men cannot knowe owne abilitie flitter ayre plundge themſelues intoo ſo deepe dungeon neuer get againe cōtrary part ſuch mind trouble themſelues vayne ſort become brutiſh ſee experience ſpecially papacie pray haue wee fayre mirrour thys doltiſhneſſe mē hold themſelues within modeſtie know nothing ſhette themſelues ought common men ſhort feare ouerſhoote themſelues curioſitie become calues brute beaſtes without vnderſtanding ſee ſuch vnderſtande woord latine intent play beaſts ſpeake thus latine mitte arcanum dei meening whereof muſt inquire god ſecretes see men retch bound continually cannot keepe good meane therfore let v remember conteyned ſtreyne god ſayeth expreſly vnto men wiſedome iob magnifieth thys knowledge god hath giuē v ſeparating v creature according ſaid firſt chapter iohn onely haue life eate drinke▪ exerciſe body alſo haue lyght vnderſtanding aſmuch benefite deſerueth bee magnified let v take good heede depriued bereft oure owne vnthankfulneſſe vvhē god openeth eye ſhut wee worthy blamed peruerters order nature god gyueth v diſcretion knowe good euil ſetteth v behold workes ende ſhoulde approch vnto parttakers image reſpect wee reaſonable creature defile know thing manifeſt fighting agaynſt god vtter renouncing benefite woulde beſtowe vpon v yea ſuch benefite moſt principal highlieſt eſteemed al others ye ſee effect two thing ought beare mind one god hath ſet men world bereue al vnderſtanding hee haue like aſſes horſes hath indued reaſon would haue vſe vnderſtanding therefore ſayd wiſedome hee ſpake purpoſely vnto vvhy ſpake alſo vnto creature bycauſe liſted like honour hee hath done v aduaunce thē ſo high degree therfore ſayd paſſe profit wiſedome liue well ſhewe go withdraw themſelues wholly creator marke one poynt ſecond alſo haue beare mind lord hath ſet v boūds may paſſe ſuch wiſe politike muſte ſtray rouers giue themſelues fonde ſpeculations dotage hold thē firſt leſſon coueting thing whiche god ſheweth lo wiſedome let alwayes entraunce intend ſhew ſelues wiſe let v harkē voyce namely lord holdeth v within ſuch liſtes haue v run receiue thinketh good teach v let v come fearing god oure wiſedome feare god ſeemeth iob reſtraineth mās wiſedome muche incloſeth wholly within feare god know lord teacheth v thing alſo word yet ſo whole wiſdome harken vnto god ſpeaketh beare minde whatſoeuer hee ſayeth make ourſelues wilfully deafe haue eye eares open whē ſheweth v ſpeaketh v according ſayde 4 deuteronomie behold thy wiſdome vnderſtanding profit ſchole thy god ſeing vouchſafeth thy ſchoolemayſter rather bin meete haue ſayde wiſdome mē inquiſitiue whatſoeuer liketh themſelues come god worde wherevnto haue hold thēſelues ſubmit thēſelues al wholly without paſsing boundes ſteade hereof iob ſayeth oure wiſedome feare god wee muſte briefly marke beſides modeſtye whereof mention hathe beene made ſheweth v heere wiſdome thing whiche edifieth v walke feare god obey meening withdraw v fayth dependeth thervpon wit knowing infinite goodneſſe god reſt thervpon ſo ſhould doubt merciful vnto v bicauſe pardoneth ſinnes lord ieſus chriſts ſake alſo hath adopted v wil loue v child procure ſaluatiō vnto end iob ſay excludeth fayth place ſpeaketh feare god hee ſheweth briefly true wiſdome ſpeculatiue ſee many men trouble diſquiet themſelues much know wote certaintie man aske ſaying haue cōprehended thing whiche hidden purpoſe ſhall profite certayne ſhall profit thē nother ſhall bee whit better ynough feede themſelues winde fooliſhe fancie puffed vp paule ſpeaketh ſaying knowledge puffeth men vp see men fondneſſe cōtrariwife iob ſaieth wiſe maner lord hath ordeyned ſhal well edified walke feare god ye ſee alſo ſayd firſt 9 chapter prouerbs feare god entrance beginning wiſdome true ſome mē take beginning apcee vvhy feare god beginning wiſdome bicauſe thing muſte begin like men firſte daſh ſet yong childe hie profounde ſciences muſte firſte teach entrāces principle take salomon word ſenſe ground thēſelues vpon whiche ſayde canonicall epiſtle iohn ſayd true perfect loue doth driue away feare place iohn ſpeaketh feare infidelles haue ſhunne god trembling maieſtie bicauſe know cace whoſoeuer haue caughte holde god goodneſſe come vnto truſte whiche nūber know god intendeth one v lord ieſus chriſt therwithal foraſmuch hath adopted v muſt doubt alwayes ſhew himſelfe louing toward v receyue v mercy ſay haue taſted afrayde aſtonied men ſpeake god like wretched offender could finde hearte iuſtice aboliſhed yee ſee ſtate vnbeleeuers half beſides themſelues eſche god aſmuch poſsible perſwaded god mercy bee drawne gracious goodneſſe ioyne wee come vnto oure head vpright time omit reuerence humilitie bycauſe fullye reſolued god lyketh well v ſo wee longer doubt vnquietneſſe wherewith wretched vnbeleeuers tormented iohn ſpeaketh ſayde feare ſayde salomon feare god chiefe beginning wiſedome ſhew chiefe poynt ſhort meening thing taught v iob men wiſe muſt learne walke feare god bee edified rule life accordingly giue themſelues ſpeculations holde mamering without certaintie ſurely heere ſee alſo salomon another text ſayeth ſelf ſame feare god fountaine life woulde call fountayne life whiche draweth men deſtruction addeth except behoued v hold v wholly perfect felici 〈…〉 wee ſee nowe meening texte namely ſuche edified feare obey god men right vnderſtanding ſame thing wherevpon muſte ſet mindes vpon wandring ſpeculatiōs eaſier vnderſtād adde one goodly text prophet eſay 33 chapter ſpeaketh true reformatiō church ſcattering deſtruction thereof therefore ſayeth thing ſeene bee turned vpſide downe ſhoulde come ſtate againe time ezechias verely inaſmuch figure lord ieſus chriſt doubt prophet eſay treateth perfection ſhould comming ieſus chriſte hee ſayeth ſtedfaſtneſſe ſtrength ſaluation ſhall wiſedome vnderſtanding tyme ezechias feare god ſhall treaſure ſee prophet declareth god knowen thing muſte go hauocke vtter deſolation like alſo ſaid another text wher prophet cōplaineth al turned vpſide downe bicauſe knowledge god lande men giuen ouer euill woonder men abuſe thēſelues wilfully ſort god giue ouer lewde minde ſo aſhamed caſte themſelues ſo outrageous haynous thing euen lothſome worlde yee ſee ſame prophete eſay ſayeth people caried deſtruction bicauſe knowledge contrary part text haue alleadged ſheweth churche ſet hir perfect ſtate againe thing brought good order ſhall wiſedome vnderſtanding bee ſtabliſhment welfare ſtrength ſhoulde ſay churche cannot otherwiſe ſtande good caſe men taught purely knowe theyr profite heere bee ſeene popiſhe churche haue pompe ynough ſee alſo dare face god diueliſh pryde ſtraine curteſie attributing theſe braue title themſelues haue holy gouernement heauen amongſte aſſuredneſſe god truth doctrine carrie holy ghoſte ſleeue holde god locked vp betweene walles yet manner knowledge haue cleane contrariwiſe ſee ſeeke nothing make wretched worlde brutiſh ſo wee may well conclude buylding god churche ouerthrowen put horrible confuſion want wiſedome whiche prophete eſay auouched bee welfare ſtrength ſtabliſhment churche thus muche concerning firſte poynt fit ſayde texte conteyned heere followeth feare god treaſure ezechias people eſay therfore doth well ſhewe whiche iob meeneth heere witte ſuche knowe thing god teacheth worde wedded theſe ſmall fonde ſuttleties bee well grounded knowledge rule life walk feare god vnder woorde treaſure hee ſheweth thing wherevppon men muſte wholly ſettle themſelues vppon full perfecte felicitie wherein muſte take full contentation reſte nowe wee ſee thing ſpoken true witte men ſhall wiſe skilfull ſhall haue profited ſo farre walke obedience god holineſſe lyfe furthermore lette v come backe hath bene touched already witte therewithall wee muſte applie oure whole ſtudie ſette whole minde vppon thing conteyued holie scripture bycauſe nothing profite ſurely vnpoſsible feare god giue ſelues ſeruice vnleſſe wee acquaynted goodneſſe according ſayde hundred thirtith pſalme lorde thou art good mercie thee ende men ſhoulde feare thee vvee ſee men bee grounded feare god vntill haue knowen god mercie taken holde ende come free hearte ſeeke ſo long wee ſhunne god fierce agaynſte conſequently rebelles men ſhall neuer conceyue ryghte taſte goodneſſe except bee taught scripture alſo place true feare wee muſte thinke vnder woorde feare scripture meeneth ſome bondage men ſhoulde yeelde vntoo god though enforced therevnto feare heere importeth wee muſte bee fully minded ſuffer ourſelues gouerned god hande aboue thing knowe goodneſſe mercie yeelde ſuch reuerence wee may truely ioyned vnto vndoubtedly hee ſpeaketh honor belōgeth vnto alledgeth maieſtie ſayth maſter lord therewithall alſo ſayeth father cryeth prophet malachie bee mayſter feare bee father loue true place hee putteth difference betweene loue feare afterwarde hee ſheweth thoſe two woordes come bothe one ende wit foraſmuche wee
