ought acknowledge father mayſter ought loue howbeeit ſuche reuerence oure life deſire nothing ne ſeeke nothing obey wee ſee nowe iob ſo farre heere intending reiect fayth hee rather leadeth v vnto alſo poynte whereat muſte beginne walke feare god cauſe sainct paule hee ſpeaketh wiſedome prayeth god open eye epheſians ende may know howe hope ſaluation god hath prepared heauen reſurrection lord ieſus chriſt afterward third chapter ſayeth behooueth v knowe kindneſſe lorde ieſus chriſt loue hath ſhewed aſſure v ſaluation inſomuche hee oure length breadth heyghth depth ſhoulde ſay wee might well ſtreyne ſelues ſides wee woulde mount vp neuer ſo high could able go beyond cōprehending loue whiche hath bin ſhewed perſon lorde ieſus chriſt alſo may well ſeeke depth yet muſt hold certaintie haue gone fro euer behooueth v knowe conceyue howe god ſheweth himſelf father ſauiour according hath adopted v perſon sonne minding make v partaker goodneſſe mercie wherin welfare conſiſteth ſee feare god behoueth v ſure goodneſſe iob hath ſet downe one particular whole purpoſely cō demne fond toyes wherevnto men gyue themſelues haue affection zeale edified feare god furthermore wee haue gather vpon text worde whiche giuen v alſo conteyned holy scripture ſo excellent treaſure cānot ſet ſtore ynough vve know wiſdome ſhall eſteemed yea euen moſt ignorant verieſt idiotes lorde hath giuen v inſight nature wee knowe true wiſedome bee amiable thing lorde decketh woorde honorable title telleth v wee profit therein thing wherein whole wiſedome conſiſteth ought inflame v greatly ſeeke thing conteyned holy scripture ſhort may profite ſchoole god muſt needes haue el wee ſhewe ſelues reiect thing deſired owne nature yea would fayne bereft vvherefore let v learne inflamed ſuche zeale profite holy scripture wee may preferre doctrine conteyned oure owne fanſies vanity worlde carie v away furthermore ynough v haue ſuche deſire profite holy scripture muſte learne alſo honour accordingly vve ſhal ſee many fantaſticall perſons theſe day deſpiſe god worde bicauſe ſeemeth nothing ſimple ſtuffe common people woulde dulling wittes ſhoulde ſet mindes vpon holy scripture lorde payeth worthie mā trie ſhall find double blind lorde bereueth common reaſon ſo become verieſt fooles doltes idiotes world see pray wage pride make account god woorde true firſt bluſh ſhall ſee great ſimplicitie lorde vſeth high ſtile rather tempereth himſelfe bothe greate ſmall yet doeth imbace maieſtie holye scripture vvhy ſo shoulde god goodneſſe deface glorie ought barre v humbling ourſelues vnto yelding due honour cleane contrary cauſe lorde ſpeaketh ſo groſly holy scripture infinite goodneſſe ſeeing wittes ſo dull ſtāmereth v seeing cace ſtandeth ſo let v learne yeeld reuerence holy ſcripture notwithſtanding lord vſe ordinary maner ſpeach yea euen ſuch groſſe ſpeach ſerueth homely folk vnlearned yet paule telleth v muſt ſo much better beholde heauenly power godly maieſtie holy scripture ſeeing paynting filed language manner worldling ſtudie rethorike colour theyr woordes fonde brauery holye scripture finde groſſe language behold maieſtie god ſheweth ſelfe therewithall fleſhly earthly thing ſet gloſſe vpon wee conuinced god diſcouereth owne arme yea conſtrayned feele ſpeake therefore ſo little ought ſimplicitie holy scripture cauſe v deſpiſe ſee proude ſtinking ſorte doo whiche make account ought rather make v perceyue god needeth borow helpes elſewhere power ſheweth ſelfe eyeſight ende wee ſhould moued honour ſubmitte ſelues wholly vnto therfore let v marke well ynough v haue good deſire profite holy scripture alſo muſt come reuerence deſire nothing embrace al conteyned hauing oure tongue filed prattle god bringing doctrine diſputations againſt pure doctrine scripture cōcluding generally ſaying looke whatſoeuer ſayde v whatſoeuer reade wee knowe truth god lorde ſeeing thou haſte ſpoken ynough v v reply meete v ſtād thou haſt vttered without gaynſaying ye ſee thing haue note worde vviſdome men drawen away theyr owne vayne imagination whē buyld newe wiſdomes ayre muſt ſay lorde hath without cauſe intitled worde name wiſdome qualifying ſort ſhew v muſt come thither ſubmit ourſelues vnto reſt wholly thing wherin lyeth whole perfectiō touching ſayde feare god like golde siluer tryed fornace tutchſtone ſo muſte tryed may knowne whither haue profited holy scripture ſay whither wee bee edified feare god vve go ſermon haue commoditie doo reade holye scripture alſo well good holy exerciſe would god wee yet much giuen vnto without compariſon yet therewithall behoueth v know whither wee haue beſtowed time well howe ſhall knowe wee skill talke giue fayre anſweres mennes demaundes bee able reſolue doubtes ſhall alledged giue fitte expoſitions texte▪ ſay thus muſt vnderſtoode true theſe thing neceſſary howe ſhall bee knowne whither wee haue profited eyther sermon reading god woorde wee ſhall know namely life yeelde recordes wee feare god token wee haue ſtudied well ſchole like ſide hath bene good faythfull ſchoolemaiſter ſo wee oure ſide haue loſte tyme thus muche haue wee marke furthermore wee ſee holye scripture intendeth giue good ſure marke diſcerne faythfull deſpizers god ſayeth let thē feare lord prayſe feare lorde enter houſe let feare god glad reioyce let men feare god reſt boldly vpon ye feare god bleſſe lord ſay true marke whereby diſcerne god flocke wilde beaſtes raunge abroade wee come sermon haue bible handes let v learne knowe god meeneth puffe v vp vayne preſumptiō knowledge ſcratch eares itch yet teach v nice poynts edifie v feare wee may honoure ſerue him▪ ſhoote marke ſhall roue holy scripture wee wont whereof cōmeth vice men cannot finde harte ſtoope take holde profite euery man forgeth wote himſelfe whereof alſo procede ſo many errours hereſies falſe opinion ſo far ſquare bicauſe know wherevnto god would guide v word alſo cauſe caſt feare god behind backes bearing ourſelues hand holy scripture giuen v far vſe ſeing men ſo abuſe godsword euery man vnhalloweth vngraciouſly ſo much behooueth v marke well texte holy ghoſt giueth v maner examination whereby trie bee good right vnderſtanding bring paſſe haue ſayd already muſte know god hee wee ſhall neuer feare aright vntill like ſheweth himſelfe v ſo knowe bee god mayſter sauiour father ſee alſo salomon text alledged firſt chapter prouerbes ſayeth knowledge holy thing true vnderſtanding ſpoken feare god ſetteth knowledge holie thing seeing holy ghoſt hath knit theſe two thing togither vnſeparable bonde behooueth v alſo knit togither hereby meeneth feare god neuer v till come poynt ſpake whiche know god mercy offered v lord ieſus chriſte namely wee bee drawne vnto goodneſſe allureth v haue boldeneſſe call vppon father ſo wee returne vntoo euen wee bee vtterlye diſmayed cauſe ſayeth ieremie let wiſe man truſt wiſdome ſtrong man ſtrength let ſuche reioyce reioyce know mee mee ſayeth lorde executeth iudgement rightuouſneſſe mercy ieremie prophet hath abated men pryde ſhewed wiſedome thoſe thinke thēſelues haue deſpiſe god ſhrinke away ſmoke leaſing bringeth poynte let wiſe man ſaieth boaſt thing knoweth god howe ſhall knowe knowing rule hath giuen v whiche hath appoynted men follow knowing protectour aſſuring ourſelues office gouerne worlde holdeth thing hand therfore let v pray receyue v protection aboue thing guyde gouerne v holy ſpirite foraſmuch ourſelues ſhould alwayes confounded aſſuring ourſelues alſo foraſmuch thereis nothing w • wretchedneſſe v muſt fayne watch welfare bring v perfection wherevnto willeth v tend trauell time life thus ye ſee wherevnto behoueth v apply indeuer wee may profite ourſelues doctrine meenes whereby god draweth v vnto feare loue true many lightheadded perſons ſpeake ynough grace lord ieſus chriſt rigtuouſneſſe giuen v babble well fayth yet neuer taſted haue grace god except rauiſhed come vnto ſo haue ſayde feare ſpoken good ſooth ſeing god hath bought v ſo derely meete euery man ſhould giuen himſelfe owne iuſtes reaſon ſeeing hee hath purchaſed v euerye one v ſhoulde dedicate himſelfe vnto become true poſſeſsion heritage seeing hath gathered v houſholde ought obedient vnto ye ſee thing wee haue marke heere lorde calleth v hee calleth v beeing aſſembled heare worde calleth v giuing v holy scripture commaunding v exerciſe ſame wee muſte come vnto ſuch wiſe acknowledge bee father mayſter learne ſubmit ſelues obedience ſeruice vnhallowe holy scripture ſeeking tryfling thing keepe forwarde continually ſayde marke knowing god ſuch ſheweth himſelfe v vttereth himſelfe word is▪ meaſure haue v paſſe turne aſide whatſoeuer come heerewithall lette v marke feare god ought alſo teache v ſhunne euill according ſet downe heere concluſion namely ſuch deſire ſubmitte themſelues vnto god rule life according muſt fight agaynſt euill thing wherevnto wee inclined nature knowe wee beſet many temptation thing turne v oure god ſo wee haue greate neede reſiſte temptation oure fleſhe allurementes worlde ſo ſtrengthen▪ ourſelues wicked affection prouoke v ſtryue agaynſte god thing whiche ſtirre v vp thereto may rather bee cutte hewen downe ſo let v marke briefly cānot go forwarde feare god renouncing ſelues haue wee elſe nature sea bottomleſſe pitte muſte caſte geare learne exerciſe ourſelues thing god ſheweth v worde ende fall confuſion whereof wee haue ſpoken maye walke obedience god profite ſchoole ſo may allowe v ſchollers wee yeld ſuch trial ſeruice ſide may accept v child ſhew himſelfe father towards v let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying forgiue v faultes paſt call v ſuch wiſe vnto may increaſed ſetled grace holy ſpirit ſo may rid frō vice fleſhe therewithall forbeare v imperfection vntil haue taken v preſent life make v partaker euerlaſting glory let v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge ſelues confeſſe truth worthy lifte vp eye vnto heauen come thy face wee ought preſume ſo far thou wilt heare prayer thou haue eye v conſciences accuſe v ſinnes beare witneſſe agaynſt v knowe thou art rightuous iudge iuſtifieth ſinners vnrightuous puniſheth faultes haue tranſgreſſed thy commaundements euen ſo lord cō ſidering whole life c ciiij sermon first vpon xxix chapter iob tooke vp parable againe ſayde 2 vvould god vvere vvas time paſt vvhen god preſerued mee 3 vvhen lampe ſhined vpon head vvalked darke light 4 vvas dayes youthe vvhen prouidence companie god vvas tent 5 vvhen almightie vvas vvith mee ſeruantes round mee 6 vvhen vvaſhed pathes butter rocke povvred mee riuers oyle 7 vvhen vvent gate citie made chayre ſet mee ſeemeth firſt ſight iob bewayleth heere time paſt grieued god chaunged ſtate afflicting ſo ſharply wheras made proſper meening ſo ſetteth himſelfe againſt thoſe iudged amiſſe affliction bene man forſaken god intent therfore ſhewe thoſe men iudged vntowardly bycauſe looked thing ſeene ſhall ſee knitting vp iob ſheweth deemed ſo ſhoulde rather haue eye tyme proſperitie vvherefore let v marke iob repineth one grieued loſſe goodes god gyuen rather reproueth aduerſaries ſhewing thē take wrong way iudge bicauſe thinke man vtterly dāned reaſon change ſee ſtate remember al time paſt bene greate reuerence excellent chozen man among others therefore reading text let v learne take example bee oute pacience thoughe god afflict v wee ought rather remember haue hearde iob ſay ſithe wee haue receyued good god hande ſhould wee bee pacient indure aduerſitie alſo whiche ſendeth vnthankfull god remembring benefites aſſuage oure griefes pleaſeth exerciſe v bring v lowe behooueth v thinke nowe hath lorde dealt ſuch wiſe v heeretofore good reaſon ſhould receiue whatſoeuer pleaſed yea ought cōfirme v god goodneſſe ſo ſhould doubt loueth v ſeing haue found ſo good vnto v experience haue wee cauſe bee contented god ſheweth loue towards v although thing fall wold wiſh thus ye ſee howe ſort behoueth v remember former proſperitie god afflicteth v muſte encreaſe heauineſſe pricke v forward grudging muſt rather bridle v ſtormed much paſsions ouerheady ſayd remembrance ſay ought aſſuage miſerie whiche wee feele god hath made v taſte goodneſſe whiche ſufficient matter comfort v againe ſeing hath ſuch care v good reaſon ſhould yeeld ourſelues wholly vnto ſuffer whatſoeuer ſhall pleaſe right neceſſarie warning v aduerſitie pincheth v wee laſt caſt ought call mind god hath preſſed v ſo alwayes hath regard feebleneſſe borne thereby witneſſed loue toward v ende ſhould truſt doubte hee ſhall haue tried pacience ſort remedie aduerſities bring v back agayne former ſtate behold ſay behoueth v practiſe doctrine affliction let v returne principal poynt iobs intent haue tolde heeretofore heere iob meeneth ſhewe aduerſaries blind iudge fooliſhly bicauſe ſtay vpon thing ſeene eye bicauſe iob ſo greate extremitie imagined god forſaken eſteemed curſed man wee haue ſeene heeretofore muſte go ſo worke muſt haue wiſedome ſpoken pſalme namely brydling ſelfe wee haue compaſsion ſuche aduerſitie furthermore wee muſte beginne point ſee man ſmitten god hand muſte conſider life hath bene hee haue bene wicked diſordered perſon lorde ſheweth v thing telleth v ſo often namely threatnings vayne behooueth v learne mannes coſte ſay walke feare wyll ſeeme nowe god looketh downehere ſuffereth thing go hauocke executeth iudgementes ſame ought teache v rightuouſneſſe ſayde prophet eſay muſt conſider playing god although wincke thing time end call thoſe account thought thē ſelues eſcaped whome worlde ſuppoſed ſhould abide vnpuniſhed yee ſee wee muſt ſettle iudgement ſimply vpon affliction conſider life hath bin whome god puniſheth ende may acknowledge chaſtizementes according deſerts better profiting ourſelues thereby wee ſee good man puniſhed ſuche wiſe god may ſeeme haue forgotten yea euen perſecute ought ſay behooueth v ſuſpend iudgementes ouer great raſhneſſe v iudge thing ſecret vnknowne therfore let v know lord intendeth humble v muſt confeſſe rightuous although reaſon doings altogither apparante ſo ought iobs freendes haue iudged cōdemned wrōgfully inaſmuch ſeene mirror holineſſe perfectiō whole life ſaw ſo ſmittē downe ſeemed god ment ouerwhelme vtterly ought haue come poynt haue ſayd know ſay wittes dazeled behalf man hath liued holily doubtles neuer wicked man whoremōger drunkard periured perſon looce liuer cruell perſon proude mā ther none al theſe thing doeth god handle ſo rigorouſlye wee cannot tell therefore god mindeth humble v ende ſhould know ſomtimes iudgementes bottomleſſe pitte v wade thē rather wee ought glorifie yea euen ſhetting eye vntill ſhew v hee woorketh ſo yee ſee wiſedome wherof pſalme maketh mention ſayeth man happy iudgeth rightly whiche aduerſitie heerewithall behoueth v alſo apply inſtruction oure lorde ſayeth god doo make greene wood bee burned ſort ſhall become drie let v compare ourſelues ſuch haue knowne bee good men haue god wee ſhall finde ſo groſſe faultes ourſelues ſhal conſtreyned ſay ala ſee well god beareth mee pitieth weakeneſſe handling ſo gently worſe ſuche man ſee ſhould compared come farre ſhort walking ſuche vprightneſſe yet notwithſtanding ſee howe god afflicteth ſtill myne eaſe reſte bycauſe woorthy god knoweth mee bee ſo weake coulde beare ſuch affliction reaſon whereof hee ſpareth mee therefore muſte impute goodneſſe bee ſtriken downe bee fayne indure affliction muſt therfore ceaſſe call ſtil vpō god aſſuring ſelfe profit welfare heare threanings muſte therevpon prepare ſelfe beare aduerſity end whē ſhall pleaſe touch v rodds wee may thinke ſtraunge bicauſe haue bene prepared good hande thus yee ſee nowe iobs meening ſheweth ſuch iudge preſent ſtate thing outwarde appearaunce ſhall conuinced experience bicauſe hee walked ſuch ſort vnblamable euery man rather woonder condemne lyfe muſt bee concluded bycauſe god afflicted ſo therfore reprobate ouer done hypocriſie vntowarde dealing way although iob ſpeake thoſe come accuſe falſely yet written inſtruction god child lo let v gather whiche haue ſayde already text namely wee muſt iudge rādon chaſtizementes rod wherwith god ſtriketh men verely muſt holde generall rule affliction witnes god iuſtice vpō ſinnes vtterly pure innocent vndoubtedly god would hādle v another faſhion doth therfore wheras ſee men ſo miſerable tormented ſo many faſhions frutes ſinnes aſwel ſeuerally cōmon yet notwithſtanding muſt meaſure men one meatyard ſay bee diuers cauſes haue declared afore god ſendeth affliction vpon world seeing god hath diuers reſpects muſt wrap vp togither make al paſſe vnder one collect ſay wee muſte bee wiſe behalfe bridle owne reaſon paſſe meaſure compaſſe vvherfore ſayd let v thinke vpon euery mās life thoſe afflicted haue deſpiſed god word led lawles life giuing thēſelues ouer naughtineſſe let v aſſure ourſelues lord inſtructeth v perſons ende ſhoulde open eye ſee faultes ſhall eſcape cleere without cōming account heauenly iudge ſee cauſe lord ſhould puniſh man rather clean cōtrary let v learne ſay lorde thou art rightuous howſoeuer world goeth true dazeled behalfe ſinfull fleſh prouoketh inforceth v murmur againſte thee neuertheleſſe wee wil ſay demaund god ſhold ſo minded coulde finde harte go lawe wil quiet pacient tarry thy leyſure till thou ſhewe thing yet hidden v yee ſee effect haue remember text herewithall let v marke alſo come iudging ourſelues wee muſte call doctrine minde intent wee fall deſpaire althoughe god preſſe v wee feele hande ouerharde vppon v wee take courage call vppon leaue comforte ſelues thus yee ſee howe behooueth v practiſe ſtyll doctrine contrariwiſe tyme proſperitie let v bee ſo ſotted oure owne eaſe pleaſure wee ſee worlde whiche abuſeth god goodneſſe ſuche wyſe become vtterly blinde excepte god conſtrayne force thinke vppon ſinnes god lette v alone reſte wee haue ſpirituall drunkenneſſe ſo wittes bee rauiſhed play reſtie iades lette v keepe v mounting ſorte pryde preſumption god maketh v proſper rather let v knowe haue ſayde already hee gyueth v leyſure diſpoſe oure ſelues receyuing aduerſities whiche ſhall ſende v beeing well aſſured pitie v handle v rigorouſly likewiſe wee ſee god letteth wicked runne rouers layeth brydle theyr necke deſtroyeth firſt brunt let v thinke make better market nother let v tempted enuy good fortune ſayd ſeuen thirtith pſalme let v exerciſe faith cace tarrying god leyſure till ſhewe v iudgementes hidden v time according v determine day houre muſte faithfull holde themſelues ſtay often lorde ſheweth himſelfe fauorable wicked ſuch haue deſerued bee quite cleane rooted wyped world although leaue proſperitie therefore fauor make vnexcuſable need muſt pay deare abuſing god pacience wiſe calleth repentaunce handling ſo gently lo effect haue marke doctrine let v come particular word iob vſeth vvhy ſayeth tyme past god kept mee ſaying god kept iob meeneth hee nowe forſaken ſettled opinion eye owne naturall vnderſtanding faithful diuers time praying vnto god may well vſe maner ſpeache ſay lord thou haſt forſaken mee lord long wilt thou forget mee lorde howe long wilt thou turne thy face mee lorde long ere thou eaſe miſerie whē faythfull ſpeake ſort think god hath forſaken vayne purpoſe call vpon god forgotten v vvhat ſhoulde gayne reſorting vnto god deſiring helpe v neede god would keepe v pray loſt labour ſay vnto lorde helpe v faithfull cōplayning god hath forſaken meene ſo v double feeling conceiuing one oure naturall witte faith thing naturall wit doth reſt vpon looke thing feele ſee touche therefore god leaueth v ſuch extremitie knowe ſhall become v ſeemeth thicke cloude betwene v vnder hād guiding yet notwithſtāding ſee god promiſeth neere hand v vvhē thinke furtheſt frō v ſhall ſeeme eye ſhut haue v thinke thus hath god ſpoken let v hardly hold v promis ſee double cō ceiuing faithfull ſtandeth v hand practiſe well ynough ſay euery man muſt put vre himſelfe vvhē aduerſitie befalleth v cānot think god hath turned back vpon v see wherevnto nature driueth v afterwarde behoueth v run immediatly promiſes god biddeth v call vpon day trouble willeth v call vpon token keeping protectiō thē ſee fayth muſt ouerrule naturall reaſon ende wee may quiet mids miſeries wayting god ſuccour walking hee commandeth v according herevnto iob ſayeth vvhere tymes become wherein god preſerued mee meeneth god hath ſhewed effect eyſight preſerued ſome mā ſhold ſay ſeeing iob ſo perſecuted ſayd god keepeth ſayd god mainteineth rather god hath forſakē wretched creature iob thē ſpeaketh heere thing deede thoughe god time forgottē ſpeketh might ſeeme mē perceyueth naturall wit howbeit reſiſted force faith reſting himſelfe vpon god promiſes fighting againſt tētation put vnto yee ſee wiſe behoueth v take text therewithall apply ourſelues ſo let v vnderſtande proſperitie muſte terme good fortune according maner mē alwaies ſo malicious rob bereue god honour belōgeth vnto muſt vſe ſuch language namely god preſerueth v vvhat cauſe god proſpereth v cauſe liue ſtill mainteyned whē beſeeged thouſand deathes bicauſe god pitieth v protectour lo behoueth v alwaies reſort god prouidēce may yeeld prayſe al benefites beſtoweth vpō v yea euē reſpect trā ſitory life furthermore whē lord chaungeth outward apperance ſuffereth v aſſaulted ſides ſo one mā pilleth v another defameth v many aduerſities light vpō v might ſayd mās ſeeming god hath forſakē v come v yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſe receyue promis god giueth v yea hope euen againſt hope leſſon taught v perſon father abrahā paule ſpeaketh iob addeth time god lightned lampe vpō walked lyght middes darkeneſſe let v marke diuers time ſaid god inlighteneth v teacheth v worde cauſe termed lampe text hath another ſenſe iob meeneth ſimply god taughte lawe reuelation holy ghoſte god giuen comfort aduerſities therwithall alſo good deſirable iſſue vvhat lampe god iobs proſperitie god ſtoode according alſo ſee ſcripture likneth afflictiōs preſent life vnto darkneſſe exāple warre troubled famine peſtilence night god countenāce hidden v know ſide turne v contrarie part lord hādleth v louingly aſmuche ſunne ſhine vpō v ſee daylight maketh men glad cō trariwiſe light maketh men ſadde heauy alſo clowdie raynie weather ſort beaten downe euery one v ſhrinketh let v marke iob doth cōtinue matter ſaying lampe god ſhined vpon hee happie ſtate euery man laughed vpon vvherein cōfirmed yet better doctrine haue touched namely neede muſt father proſperitie world vpon fortune ſee theſe worldling looke vnto god hād nother weale wo therfore muſte ſo rather whenſoeuer haue proſperitie let v conſider god ſhineth vpon v ſheweth v louing countenance would haue v know father might glorifie behold lord ſheweth v countenance proſperitie end ſeeing might haue occaſion prayſe goodneſſe alſo drawen vnto gentle allurement might giue v courage loue yeelde oureſelues ſeruice nowe wee ſee theſe manner ſpeeches ſuperfluons ſtead ſaying manner vnbeleeuers haue good fortune haue liued mine eaſe iob ſayeth god ſhone vpon lampe addeth god giuen lyght middest darkeneſſe hee ſayeth bicauſe poſsible muſt many inconueniences daungers worlde meane euen thoſe ſeeme haue thing would wiſh although perceyue ſome man exempted trouble yet notwithſtanding ſo long vpon earth muſt nedes walke among thornes vve ſhall alwayes threatned many death though man haue garner cellers full yet ſayde may made poore turning hand let v marke well middes worlde wee alwaies darkeneſſe ſay beſette many trouble daungers inſomuch lord prouided v could ſtep one pace forward ſo much ſtirre one finger ſhoulde ſtumble many miſeries god remedieth thing ſhewing v lampe making ſhine vpon v therfore let v learne yeelde prayſe deſerueth cānot holde tranſitorie life vnleſſe wee doo alwayes looke vpon v guide v let v pray guiding v alſo make v feele effect neere v hath v ſuch ſort protection exempted many miſeries bicauſe ſuffereth v fall god deſerue haue prayſe yeelded vnto reſpect thing concerne ſtate life pray deſerueth reſpect inſtructiō giueth v word lōg liue liue darkneſſe peter ſayth blinde wretch moreouer reſpect wittes ſo groſſe headed neceſsitie ſhould fall confuſion euery ſteppe wee inlightened lampe god word vve ſee great thicke darkneſſe nede know god goodneſſe open eye beholde bee diligent marke ende may honour benenefites deuour depende wholly vpon prouidence thus much haue marke ſentence conſequently ſayde iob time youth prouidence god alſo tent hebrew worde whiche hee vſeth heere doeth ſignifie latertime ſimilitude taken youth youth fifteene yeeres time man cheefe courage luſtineſſe yeres fiue twenty vnto yeeres fiue thirty man cheefe floure begetting child ſome haue expoūded fond groſſe bycauſe man full ripeneſſe giue counſell doo thing belongeth man life age wee ſee men ſo diſpoſe themſelues may bee put dooing ſome ſeruice like latter time bringeth foorth frutes ſo alſo age man fit yeelde frutes ſay bee imployed ſome ſeruice texte man may well take worde ſignification ſometimes otherwyſe alſo ſimilitude whiche would later ſeazon ſay time men gathered frutes mine aboundance lo iob meeneth vvhen ſpring tyme yere ſee blade ſhall beare corn ſhooteth foorth vynes beginne budde howbeeit yet nothing hope vve ſee meddowes ſpring vp greene graſſe latter ſeaſon cattell fatte well fed bycauſe haue paſture ryches earth gathered layde vp thus yee ſee tyme aboundance ſo doubte iob ment ſaye ryches god gyuen mee ſo greate aboundance good flowed houſe afterwarde hee addeth prouidence company god vpon tent purſewing matter talked already hebrewe word iob vſeth ſignifieth prouidence company agree well therefore men neede trouble themſelues much ſenſe continueth one therefore meening prouidence god vpon tent ſay whē god watched ouer mee guide affayres elſe god kept mee company ſay found fauorable vnto ſo neere hold lap heere iob continueth acknowledging god benefites lette v marke well man tormented ſort notwithſtāding ſo farre beſides himſelfe alwaies glorified god ſayd v thinke vpon god whē letteth v alone quietly middes eaſe vve know man pinched aduerſity ſo diſmayed hee remembreth nother god himſelfe caried away wit amazed ſtate iob haue ſeene neuer yet almoſte creature tormented faſhion yet neuertheleſſe ſeene ſtill directeth himſelfe vnto god glorifieth confeſsing benefites receyued time paſte fell caſuall aduenture purchaſed owne trauell pollicie hee beholding vntoo men howe god ſayth hath lighted lāpe vpon hath guided hath bene hand mee vvhen iob ſpeaketh ſo ought record cō demne thoſe men double treble ſo diſmayed yet neuertheleſſe doo forget god ſwallowe vp benefites without honor let v learne glorifie god thing example iob proſperitie aduerſitie ſo ſaying hee addeth ſtate time god companion garde wit feete bathed butter riuers flowed vnto oyle theſe ſimilitudes iob ſignifieth god ſet ſuch proſperitie wanted nothing ſayth trode butter bathed ſteppes much ſay god made walke vpon pleaſant thing according ſayd foureſcore eleuenth pſalme faithfull ſhall borne vp handes angel ſo feete ſhall ſtumble daſh agaynſt thing amiſſe ſame maner iob ſayth text beholde god hath delt ſo time paſt treade vpon ground neither felt hard pauement vnder rather god made mee path butter ſweete thing ſhort meeneth inſtead common ſtate men ſwimme pleaſures ſotted himſelfe doo rauiſhed loue theyr owne cace ouerioy ouerſhoote themſelues thing glutton drunkard wanton folke iob intended ſuch thing meeneth god hilde ſo great proſperitie hee able expreſſe exceſſe word herein ſene magnified god benefites much could like alſo ought poynt ought marke well bicauſe inforced cōfeſſe good god hath done v acknowledging magnifie ſo highly ſo great benefite ought bee rather diminiſh owne maliciouſnes lo howe god abated due v though ſome man coulde denie whole debt ſhoulde ſay ô thought bee ſo much according ſee theſe euill paymaſters ſo ſhameleſſe ſay owe nought thing knowne euident ynough could find hart make hundred florens fiue poſsible euen ſo play wee god wee nicke vnkindneſſe vnfaythfulneſſe diminiſhing gift ought magnifie contrariwiſe iob ſheweth v whē god hath done v good wee muſt thinke diſcharge ſelues ſaying one worde much beholden vnto god commeth grace theſe trifling ceremony muſt learne eſteme god benefit according worthie good fayth pray let v conſider ſtate whence lorde hath drawne v let v conſider ſide wee haue deſerued hee ſhoulde ſtretch hande helpe v beſtowe creature vpon v v ſeruice let v marke theſe thing little ſurely ſhall find cleane contrarie wit god ought ſhake v altogither yet notwithſtanding ceaſſeth v good therfore let v learne eſteeme fatherly loue hee beareth v taſt earneſtly wee haue done hitherto lo wee haue marke ſimilitude butter oyle ſhould ſay compare ſelfe others find ſelfe ſo greatly bound vnto god poſsible acknowledge ſufficiently herevpon ſheweth honour wherein ſpoken rich ſaying feete bathed butter ſtones yelded honie ſay euen hardſt thing turned vnto pleaſure ſheweth honour eſtimation gouerners ſayth taryed gate made chayre ſet mee euery man yeelded mee honor reuerence vvhen iob ſayeth ſo way bragging beareth ſhame god layde vpon humilitie reproueth aduerſaries ſhould ſay iudge mee nowe damned curſed man ye ſee mee wretched carkaſſe deſtitute helpe euerie man ſcorneth ſee whither ye iudge rightly long ago ſince honored men would haue douked therfore iudgement right indifferent bicauſe ſtay vpō viſible thing wheras ought looke ſee iobs meening vvherefore according hath bin declared foraſmuch wee go let v learne oft lorde doth v good let v learne ſay acknowledge ſame commeth fortune hand god contrary part whenſoeuer pleaſeth afflict v let v know intent waken v meanes ſerueth put v hart humble v therefore let v ceaſſe reſort ſtill vntoo aſſuring ſelues hath beaten v roddes well cure v againe knoweth remedy fitteſt welfare nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele ſuch wiſe beeing hartely ſorie may ſeke nothing rid ſelues fleſhly affection wee may bee fully clothed holy ſpirite ende may yeeld ſelues obedience may know howe profite ſelues ſuch wiſe owne affliction affliction neighbour may ſtill inſtructed feare glorifie iudgements bee ſo wrapped theſe preſent thing wee may alwayes looke higher middes affliction may ceaſſe reſort vnto good god truſting wil continue goodneſſe towards v euen till ſhew v thing effect experience nowe warranteth worde may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people c cv sermon ſecond vpon xxix chapter 8 vvhen yong men ſavve mee hidde themſelues prince roſe vp ſtoode vpon feete 9 gouerners left ſpeaking vvhen ſpake layde hande vpon mouth 10 prince hilde peace tongue cleaued roofe mouth 11 eare heard ſayd vvas happie eye ſavv vvitneſſed vvith 12 deliuered poore vvhen cryed helped fatherleſſe vvas ſuccorleſſe 13 bliſsing vvas readie periſhe came vpon mee comforted heart vvidovv precious thing warelier ought man kepe wiſely diſpoſe put better vſe ſee euery man doeth ſo reſpect worldely good true ſome ſpare nothing waſt yet euen thoſe know vice reproued men know order good thing ought ſet ſtore howbeeit herewithall although confeſſe honeſtie man cheefe treaſure yet notwithſtanding men make ſpare ſell little naught proofe heereof loke vpon moſt reputation menne make moſte curteſiie eſtimation theyr vertues cleane contrarie man aske thoſe humble themſelues great riche one moueth ſo doo ſay bycauſe worthie owne conſcience beareth witneſſe moſte parte ſtarke naught vve ſee honeſtie quite ſhaken yet notwithſtanding men well ynough ſay moſt precious thing foule fault according alſo wee ſee howe ſaint iames ſcorneth alſo ſharpely rebuketh thoſe honour wicked ſort defiling thing god hath dedicated good vſe vvhat ought men honour ſauing god proceedeth therefore wicked men ſuche reputation thing belongeth vntoo god plucked giuen diuell true wicked man bee aucthoritie men may well honour reſpect owne perſone reſpect office vice eſtimation prayſed vertues mingle mangle ouerthrowe order therfore ought marke well text whereas iob ſpeaketh honour done vntoo hee ſayth reaſon ryches credite vertues young men ſayeth bee hidde themſelues ſawe mee vvhat moued yong men hyde themſelues man paſſe boundes yong men rather take boldeneſſe doo euill ſhall haue ſuche ſhadowe proppe beare vp men ſtoode ſo much awe iob hid themſelues ſight ſigne ſuch vertues men inforced honour ryches lo haue marke firſt place herewithall let v marke alſo word hyde importeth ſhame thoſe feared god yet neuertheleſſe hilde awe men loth haue lewdneſſe knowne ſpecially vertuous man haue ſome grauitie come way meene euill hyde themſelues hys preſence purpoſe ſerueth ſuch ſhamefaſtneſſe ſeemeth ſuperfluous thing certaine man abſteyne dooing euill onely reſpect ſome perſon thereby ſheweth hath yet profited alſo ſlender honouring god yet notwithſtanding commeth double profite one like childe know reaſon haue diſcretion ſhall neuertheleſſe bee inured good thing euen ſo lord cauſeth ſhamefaſtneſſe ſelfe naught ſerue drawe thoſe forward little little haue yet proceded ſo farre loue vertue owne ſake example looke vpon man vnconſtant hath feare loue god yet rooted altogither dazeled taketh leaue euill ouerſhoote himſelfe yet hath ſtill bridle vtterly paſt ſhame vvee ſhall ſee diuers themſelues commonly bee ouerſeene euill companie man ſhall ſooner intice ſuche amiſſe bend fro yet al haue ſhamefaſtneſſe ſoone man whome reuerence doeth caſt eye aſide vpon bee ſo abaſhed could finde heart bee buried man tell faultes haue word anſwere rather fal weping reply thus ye ſee ſome token man altogither paſt hope amendment hee keepeth ſtil modeſtie knowing ſhamefulnes owne ſinne neuertheleſſe euident ſhamefaſtneſſe vertue ſelf howbeit ſuch man come home little little lorde cauſeth medicine ſerue ſirop preparatiue agaynſt ſome diſeaſe end pacient may afterwards receyue ſome ſtrong medicine lo heere ſirop doeth alter commeth healeth pacient yet good preparatiue man hath taken halfe chaunge ſort ſo hee readie aforehand medicine medicine hath force like cace ſhamefaſtneſſe ſelfe able heale vyces clenſe v make v walke becommeth v prepareth v ſo wee vtterly paſſe boundes thus ye ſee one vſe profit lord picked ſhamefaſtnes wauering light mynded folke ſayde haue ſuch foundation ought haue feare name well rooted yet one vſe wit excuſes taken v god giueth v marke hee ingraued brended forehead ſay cannot iuſtifie fault vvhy ſo go hyde mee preſence man cauſe shame whence commeth ſhame god hath printed mee ſearingiron inſomuche whereas otherwyſe woulde ſuffer ſunne heauen earth men beare witneſſe lewdneſſe yet notwithſtanding reſtrayned ſee men ſhall point finger ſhall bee hated abhorred vice curſed ſelfe vvee ſee ſhamefaſtneſſe men haue proceſſe god maketh agaynſt v aforehande ſhoulde charge iewrie take information inditements agaynſt v end ſhould caſt notwithſtanding al ſhifts could alledge yet neuertheleſſe brondmarke ſhoulde bewray vice vice worthy condemned ſo although man bee otherwiſe blockiſhe touched whitte knoweledge ſinnes yet inaſmuch hath ſhamefaſtneſſe meanes made vnexcuſable nowe wee ſee doctrine wee haue gather ſtreyne firſt lorde warneth v haue ſhame euill ſhun men preſence would loth haue lewdneſſe knowne wee muſt vnderſtande thereby god aduertiſeth v v flatter ſelues ſinnes hide rather wee muſt learne condemne furthermore bee ſo abaſhed men let v aſſure oure ſelues wee cannot eſcape preſence god vvee maye well locke vp oure ſelues oure lurking hole wee ſhall gaine nothing eie muſt alwayes ſee v onely marke workes bee ſeene worlde alſo ſecreteſt deepeſt thoughtes therefore let v learne feare men ſpecially heauenly iudge ſeeth v alſo let ſaid ſhamefaſtneſſe gouern v muſt ſtay haue ſayd alreadie one childe ſhould abyde alwayes apcee elſe ſick man ſhould content himſelfe preparatiue afterwarde die vpon want taking phiſick muſt ſhamefaſtneſſe raigne alone v muſt leade v wit although men perceiue defaultes wee might haue couerings hyde ſelues withall beguile worlde yet neuertheleſſe owne conſcience may watch keepe ward iudgement god may preſſe v may ſo diſpoſe whole life wee may deſire onely good reputation men alſo allowed god bringing heereof paſſe wee muſt onely abſteyne open euill harte alſo muſt clenſed muſt haue affectiōs corrected ſo wee may haue backe nooke hyde filthyneſſe thus ye ſee haue remember ſtreyne yet notwithſtanding wee ſee tymes wee bee dayes like feare god ſo ſhame men iniquitie doeth ſo ouerflowe bee moſt ſhameleſſe moſt valiant leaſtwiſe youth ought haue ſome modeſtie vndoubtedly without cauſe paynim owne naturall witte knowe ſhamefaſtneſſe peculiar vertue yong folkes yong folke yet ſo well gouerned requiſite full boylings ſtirre vp vnto euill fire heade therewithall luſts ſo violent hard repreſſe herevnto lorde giueth remedie although yong folke verie headie yet notwithſtanding conuicted conſtreyned know thēſelues perceyue haue yet ſuch ſtayedneſſe requiſit cauſe haue ſome ſhamefaſtneſſe thē ſeene nowadayes wāteth ſtore yong ruſſians behold theſe yong cockerel ſooner cropen ſhell muſt haue ſworde ſide ſhall ſee vtterly voyde al ſhame think ought bee like brothel ſtewes whatſoeuer doo neyther reuerence iuſtice anye thing elſe ought gouerne bee ſhort wee ſee youth become altogither diueliſh feare god alſo honeſtie sith ſee let v aſſure ſelues floud iniquitie thing ſo farre order paſt remedie appeareth thing ought bee imprinted nature al men ſpecially yong folke ſay ſhamefaſtneſſe modeſtie quite razed yong folk vtterly ſhameleſſe ſtubborne paſſe though mocked vnſhamfaſtneſſe let v learn walke greater feare carefulneſſe ſhall bee excuſed alledging euerie man dooth wee doo meanes acquite v god ſay bee better ſelues rather let ſame occaſion vnto v drawe backe wee bee wrapped vyces raigne ſo men furthermore let v remember howe hath bin ſayde muſt walke men looke onely vpon creature let v ſet god eye according alſo cannot ſcape preſence true inclination hypocriſie wee ſeeke many windlaſſes ſtartingholes yet muſt god needes follow v euery seeing ſo let v learne dedicate ſelues wholly vnto haue ſight faſtened vpon foraſmuch hee inlighteneth v worde let v thinke alſo vpon apoſtle telleth v epiſtle hebrewes declareth worde wee heare ſame nature god himſelf ſearch thought try al v deuide aſunder mary bone veynes v seeing thē lord ſendeth v word make ſuch triall euer lieth hid men muſt come light let euery v walk brode day conſider darkneſſe ſeing lord ieſus chriſt reigneth among v goſpel thus ye ſee ye haue remēber text iob addeth prince roſe vp afore yea cheef men gouerners bild peace heard ſpeake wee ſee order nature teacheth malapertneſſe men peruerteth thing follow lord ſheweth ſay euen according order nature certaine man gift teaching iudgement knowledge men ſhould harkned vnto euery mā would hold peace ſpake vvhat cauſe whē man ſhall ſpeake good reaſon haue gift edifie others receyued diſpiſed many bablers thruſt themſelues foorth needes heard tongue running ryot meanes whereof truth ſhall put backe thruſt vnder foote cauſe thereof men cannot abyde god ſhould guyde gouerne ſay corrupt order nature malapertneſſe rather madneſſe needes muſt become wood beaſtes wee cannot abyde ſubmit ſelues truth reaſon admitte ordeyned ouer v god ſteade therefore let v marke well text iob meeneth magnifie owne perſone onely vndoubtedly meening vvhat yeſterday ſhewed peculiar reaſon hee ſpeake ſo may gather alſo generall doctrine god giueth v iobs mouth whiche vpright vertuous man therewithall indued wiſedome wee muſt giue eare receyue among v wee followe rule whiche ſhewed v heere wee onely doo wrong vnto mortall man alſo god taketh ſame wrong done owne perſone without cauſe man bee able gouerne v good doctrine thinke wee hee hath himſelfe euerie manne well ynough ſay gyft god nowe god aduaunceth manne ſuche wiſe gyuing hym largely holye ſpirite intent hee ſhoulde purchaſe himſelfe eſtimation rather common profite men hee ſo indued wyth great giftes bounde ſo muche neighbour muſt ſo beſtowe giuen menne maye bee partaker nowe wee vouchſafe heare man wee may profite vnder deſpyſing spirite god ſcorning maieſtie whiche hee woulde haue bee knowne hee ſendeth v mortall man ſort name furthermore pride matched vnthankefulneſſe beholde god rayſeth vp men able teache v let v onely heare ſhall bee welfare vouchſafe doo reiecting benefite god offereth v muche v lyeth nought tolde v heere bee vertuous man whiche hath skill oure ſelues hee deſerueth haue eare gyuen men ſhoulde bee heedfull receyue whiche hee ſhall ſay haue declared alreadie men doo wrong offered vntoo god wee alſo vnthankefull wee gouerned yet wee ought heare men whiche haue ſome worldely skill ought wee doo purpoſely ſent bring v god worde ſo furniſhed may ſay god ſendeth v meſſage ſaluation theyr mouthes according hee ſerued turne prophetes apoſtles lyues haue ſame order gouernment bee day churche continue vntoo worldes ende wee refuſe heare god worde preached ſuch ordeyned office double rebellion ſhall wee bee ſo much blame wee bee warned keepe ſilence lord ſendeth v worde maketh great ſmall ſtoupe vnto bee dumbe deafe ſay wee muſte bee tonguetyde god ſpeaketh ſtandeth v hand herken without replying receyue quietly whatſoeuer ſayde vnto v conclude amen bee againe muſt bee deafe foraſmuch ſee nature bee ſo ill diſpoſed heare god obey worde haue pray open eares correct dulneſſe hearing v ſlowneſſe obeying ſpecially gyue v vnderſtanding elſe wee bee ſo brutiſhe wee ſhoulde neuer conceyue thing welfare except inlightened holy spirite therefore let v learne brydle onely tongue affection thing hindereth v hearing god beeyng taught woorde onely wee bee talkatiue full babbling prittleprattle alſo bycauſe wee bee full luſtes gainſtryuings breake god talke let euery man looke well himſelfe wee come sermon otherwiſe looke vpon holy scripture doubt wee ſhall well vnderſtande ſome good ſayings profitable ſentences heere ſlippeth v forget againe ſo combered owne gainſtryuings therefore one great noyze v brake god worde ſo receyued againe wee beare away hundredth part tolde v bycauſe bee fleſhly affection carie v away haue ſayde wee mynde fare better god worde muſt onely brydle tongue ouer lauiſh muſt alſo bridle affection ende may bee peaſable obedience yeelded god thus ye ſee wee haue marke neuertheleſſe wee muſte alſo haue ſayde ſoberneſſe modeſtie beeing haſtie ſpeake rather yeelde oure ſelues teachable ſayde wyſe manne ſhall wexewyzer hearing salomon ſpeaketh ignorant idyots ſo much men take themſelues bee great clearkes doctor fyrſt day beare themſelues hande haue profited ynoughe aſſoone haue anye little taſte doctrine good ſooth men ſwell bigge ynoughe euen lyke toades howbeeit theyr ſwolneneſſe wynde foraſmuche men haue ſuche ouerweening themſelues therefore salomon ſayeth ſo wyze man hee groweth wyzer hearing vvhat bee done vvee muſte bee ſo forwarde ſpeake wee muſte alſo bee readie hearken heare tolde v lo wee haue beare alwayes mynde vppon ſtreyne verely ſeeing iob ſayeth expreſſely gouerners euen ſuche practyzed wiſedome bare authoritie among men gyuen eare bycauſe hee excelled pray ſhall become chalendge ſuche skill themſelues haue lyke practyze borne office whereby get ſo muche vnderſtanding yet neuertheleſſe leſſe wee ſee verye fewe nowe adayes abyde bee taught euery man taketh vpon teacher ſee howe ill practiſe leſſon giuen v saint iames ſayeth muſt couet bee many maſters contrarywiſe none v hee thinkes himſelfe able guide whole worlde meane man abyde bee taught tolde thing though bee yong calfe much ought marke circumſtance haue purpoſely touched concerning iob holy ghoſte prayſeth men wyſe authorite notwithſtanding yeelded themſelues peaſable refuſed taught seeing holy ghoſt ſheweth v let v vnderſtande onelye commende perſons vnknowne v day giue v example inſtruction wee haue preſent admonition needeth conſidering pryde v ſayde euerie man bee wiſe man finde heart ſtoupe ſo lowe confeſſe hee hathe neede bee taught others thus cauſe holy ghoſt ſetteth v downe ſuche inſtruction heere although wee excellenteſt men worlde yet muſt wee imagine ſuch perfection ſelues wee haue neede profite yet heerewithall let v marke well giftes god vvhen wee ſee man ſent v teach v let v vnderſtande god hath ſent v treaſure releeue oure want withall ſtandeth v hande receyue ſame god fountayne al wiſdome true neuertheleſſe hee maketh runne downe vntoo v ryuers chanels men receyue giftes hande diſtribute v meanes although man haue great gift yet muſt wee giue hearing ſpeake reaſon truth yea though yong childe tolde v faultes yet hee meſſenger god ſending nowe wee may refuze little childe ſilly idiot hathe authoritie excellente gift muſt receyue correction hande pray muſt wee needes wittes wee reiect manifeſt giftes god hee woulde haue bee magnified ſetting open place bee ſeene muſt bee ſayde wee ſtarke madde reiect foraſmuch haue neede continually ſtrengthened receyuing doctrine inſtruction meanes bee offered long liue worlde let v accept god gift ſayd whereſoeuer ſee let v honour ſubmit ſelues thus yee ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne iob declareth hee beene honoured commended onelye hauing ſharpe ſuttle vnderſtanding alſo mainteyning right among men ſentence well worthy bee noted true man meddleth teaching hys neighbor ynough bee honeſt man haue deſire liue well giue good example men hee muſt alſo haue skilfulneſſe god muſt haue giuen wit reaſon neuertheleſſe man skilfull coulde bee wiſhed tongue readie vtter ſo blemiſhe ſpeache yet euill conſcience ſo ſcorner god heatheniſhe man life hee deſerueth bee heard life maketh ſuſpected ſo men hardly take taſt doctrine meene wickedneſſe mennes lyues ought diminiſhe authoritie god worde ſpeake common infirmitie v inſomuche wee ſee man wicked frowarde withoute vprightneſſe dooings ſcorneth vertue ſuche man ſpeake angell yet woulde men vouchſafe heare woulde thinke themſelues deceyued bycauſe ſee hee ſpeaketh heart therefore requiſite thing dealeth teaching haue ſayde vprightneſſe men may knowe ſpeaketh heart feinedly telleth tale ieſt like player maye play part enterlude yet done ieſt cauſe ſayde ynough ſpeake well hee myndeth teache others muſt onely ſpeake hys tongue alſo deale ſo men may know ſame commeth heart muſt ſo ratifie ſee doctrine deedes men may ſee thing ſpeaketh ſo ſettled heart ſo printed ingrauen hee ſpeaketh preſence god ye ſee wee haue marke ſentence iob reported bin commended greateſt honourableſt ſort men addeth bycauſe ſuccoured poore afflicted bliſsing readie periſhe bin vpon hee bin defender fatherleſſe protector widowes vprightneſſe purchaſed authoritie according ſayd fiftenth pſalme muſt honour aboue men haue feare god ſurely declared long ago ſeeing feare god wiſdome yea euen true wiſdome wee muſt alſo cōſider whether man deſerue heard furthermore man walketh vprightly giueth good aſſurance ſpeech feyned diſſembler doth babble teeth outward hath affection hart man bee ſuch one whole life warranteth hee intendeth teach men good earneſt intent god may ſerued honored let v aſſure ſelues muſt take ſuch one mirrour looking glaſſe make recking good life ſuch ought teach v reiect aſſurance god giueth v doctrine true haue ſaide men cannot barre worde god continuing full ſtate dependeth vpon vertuous behauiour men howſoeuer worlde go god ſo gracious vnto v teach v ſuch men witneſſe liues onely ſeeking men ſhoulde ſerue god ſay haue ſuch recorde ſealing doctrine one god ſhould relieue infirmitie driuing pricking v forward bycauſe hee ſeeth v ſo negligent ſlowe come vntoo ſigne bee ſlouthfull beaſtes wee make accompt let v marke well ſentence touched iob therewithall let ſuche haue charge teach others looke wel themſelues behaue themſelues ſuch wiſe life may pattern men beare witneſſe ſpeak vaine ſpeake word god thoroughly ingrauen let v alſo take warning perſons haue worde god eſtimation wee may yeelde ſelues obedience well thus ye ſee thing miniſters magiſtrates ſuch haue charge gouern people generally ſuche haue degree vocation teaching ought thinke vpon namely lord ſhould ſhew way calling office vpon condition ſhoulde onely ſpeake alſo witneſſe ſame earneſtly truely life yea doctryne extendeth men generall man hee ought teach neighbour tyme place conuenient neede requireth therefore let v conſider condemning men wee hyde oure owne fault ne cauſe bee forgotten hee would good correctour neighbour muſt firſt correct himſelfe teach men muſt firſt bee owne ſchoolemayſter ſay muſt begin himſelfe receyue good doctryne alſo let v forget wee haue ſayde namely wee muſt readie receiue inſtruction euery man hand yeeld ſelues teachable without refuſing ſo great benefit lorde goeth teach v maner perſon touching whiche iob ſayeth effect hee hath ſhewed himſelfe bee man feared god led ambition woulde fayne ſhewe themſelues bee men renoume neuer thing looke ſome prayſe commendation afore men contrariwiſe iob declareth beſtowed doings hope recompence purchaſing great fame renoume worldwarde hee indeuered good vnto men euen ſeemed dead hereby ſheweth wel led vaine glorie ſought hire beneath earth walked ſight god man ſeeke owne preferment certaine hee ought man good turne hee looke twice vpon ſee whether partie bee able counteruaile render like like thus ye ſee none good turnes done worlde done freely rather wage therfore doings ſayd vertue charitie leadeth good one another helpe ſuch haue neede euery man hath eye owne profit ſee whether good doth vnto others may returne home againe himſelfe contrariwiſe ſhewed v heere ſeruing god wee muſt haue regarde worldly recompence couet commended prayſed according wee ſee howe iob ſayeth bliſsing readie periſh came vpon let v marke well ſaying man deathes dore ſeemeth v whatſoeuer good ſhall haue vnto good loſt alſo worldwarde quite gone veryly iob ſpeaketh ſuch vtterly forſaken ſuccour inſomuch man vouchſafed thinke vppon buryed man wretched coarſe ſuccour ſo reſpect bee purchace prayſe among men certaine ſeeke ſome man blaſe abroade goodneſſe tell much hee beholding bounde vnto mee take poore man good halfe dead ſeemeth hee muſt periſh hande token ſeeke prayſe men agayne hyre ſhall looke man condemned death hope wee minde proceede ſuch vprightneſſe wee muſt thruſt ambition vnder foote muſte couetouſneſſe leade v muſt looke right forth vntoo god thing iob ment betoken effecte ſame alſo cauſe hee ſetteth downe heere particular haue touched namely widowes fatherleſſe child ſuche bee deſpyſed whole worlde vndoubtedly theſe alſo party ſpecially recommended vntoo v god haue meanes recompence good turnes ſhall haue receyued recommend themſelues poore man deſtitute fauour hath neyther kinſfolke freendes goodes authoritie ſide wee ſuccour ſigne wee looke rightfoorth vntoo god wee token charitie v truely foraſmuche euerye one v ſo wedded owne profit therfore doth lord expreſly commend vnto v widowes fatherleſſe thoſe ſuch extremitie able helpe themſelues god ſay preſenteth vnto v trie charitie behalfe yee ſee poynt iob ſtandeth v hande marke yea marke ſuche wiſe wee muſte aſſure ſelues theſe thing ſpoken learning haue touched alreadie iob vſeth brauerie neither maketh brag get himſelf eſtimation rather perſon holy ghoſt ſheweth v eſteemed namely appeareth outwardly hath fayreſt gloſſe afore men oftētimes ſhal abhomination god vvhat man walketh hauing none record god ſo doings leuelled marke ſay god hath commaunded thing wherein trie thing whervnto tasketh man walketh rule one ſhould baniſh worldly reſpects gather himſelfe vnto god euen ſo alſo muſt let v ſeke none alowance god let ſuffice content v let v turned aſide drawne away ambition vainglorie vvhen intend ſerue god let v looke recompence man hande let v ſerue god ſuch vnfeynedneſſe ſoundneſſe wee maye ſtay vpon thing haue fayreſt ſhewe vpon thing commaunded v let v fully conclude reſolued wee ought deſire god obeyed therfore theſe thing let v follow ſtill example iob ſhew feare god yea let ſhewing bee wote ceremony wherein ſubſtance thing oure lorde commaundeth v eſpecially hys lawe whiche wee ſhoulde execute iuſtice rightuouſneſſe mercie ſay wee ſhoulde yeelde euery manne right wee ſhoulde abſteyne euill iniurie craft violence indeuour ſerue neighbour cheefely hauing pitie compaſsion vpon thoſe aduerſitie ende ſuccour abilitie god hath giuen v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying haue pitie vppon v make v ſo feele oure ſinnes wee may bee humbled true repentance come ſeeke perſon lord ieſus chriſt hee ſhall haue receyued v mercie may pleaſe ſo guide v holy ſpirite glory may ſhine v meane may couet bee honoured men holde ſelues contented glorie ſhineth ſo v name bee exalted may pleaſe make v walke ſuche ſoundneſſe vnder obedience ſuch wander go aſtray may bee brought way ſaluation meanes oure example ſo v togither may ſerue one common accord tyme lyfe performance heereof may pleaſe ſtyrre vppe true faythfull miniſters hys worde c cvj sermon third vpon xxix chapter 13 bliſsing vvas readie periſh vvas vpon mee comforted vvydovves heart 14 vvas clothed vvith rightuouſneſſe apparayled ſelfe vvith iudgement vvith robe crovvne 15 vvas eye blinde foote cripple 16 vvas father poore ſought diligently cace knevve 17 brake chavves vvicked plucked pray teeth wee began yeſterday ſhewe howe iob giueth triall vertues mā feareth god doth good without regard worlde without ſeking recompence led either ambition ſelf profit walketh ſight god thoſe make ſhew vertue yet notwithſtanding walke vprightly good haue alwayes eye whether men able recompence may prayſed cōmēded purchaſe credite menes man giue himſelf good freely ſay without hope recompence worlde ſame ſheweth minded ſerue god therefore iob declareth hee regarded whether thoſe good able recompence rather imploy himſelf vpō pore fatherleſſe widowes lame blind herein ſheweth whole intent ſerue god beſides ſheweth led ambition ne ſought mē ſhould cōmend ſo holdeth himſelf cōtēted bliſsing ſhould haue periſhed vpō importeth much ſhoulde ſay hath deſire ſuccour thoſe alredy good halfe dead ſemed ſhewed fauor thē good ſame ſhould loſt ſhould neuer ſpoken reſpect hindreth iob well bicauſe hee ſure although men die god kepeth reckning doings continue regiſters ſhort ſee always iob none thoſe drawne hither thither fleſhly affection alwayes eye vpon mark regarding following thing god aloweth ye ſee ought rule life iob preacheth owne prayſes ſheweth v ought behaue ſelues foraſmuch nothing eaſier aduaunce ſelues world laugheth vpon v men prayſe v reputation credit iob bringeth v vnto god telleth v onely iudge perteyneth authority gouern v lawmaker ſo alſo muſt ſeeke pleaſe obey al ſay mark one point heerewithall let v marke alſo god trie loue beare offereth v ſuch perſons haue meanes recompence v behold true proof ſerue god wee ſerue neighbor haue neither pleaſured helped v afore ſhal ſeme haue loſt labor coſt yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe imploy ſelues ſtyll vvhy ſo inough v god alloweth doings thing make v play hireling ſeing ſo let v well aduiſed whenſoeuer ſee poore men aduerſitie miſintreated whē ſome neceſsitie want worldly good ſome wreſted wronged men ſome ſtand need counſell otherſome lack helpe doth god meane trie charitie putteth hee v touchſtone ſhrink aſide poore cryeth giue eare thereby ſhew neyther zealous willing ſerue god let v aſſure ſelues threate poore cried thou wouldſt heare therefore thou ſhalt crie heard neyther ſhall man pitie thee ſhall executed vpon heades ſhall find mercy neither god man wee haue bin pitileſſe ſuch god hath ſent v bee ſuccoured thereafter hart ſhall haue beene hard vnkinde ſo god ſhet eye ſuch ſee v pouertie ſo ſhall haue remorſe v wee may well complaine ſmart man ſhall regard payment wee deſerued compaſsion thoſe diſtreſſe ſpecially ſeeing god ſendeth v ſuch tryall purpoſe know whether willing ſerue bee ſhort wee ſee heere mercie one principall part life ruled god order importeth ſaying euen ſee man aduerſitie hath neede helpe ſhould ſorie hart ſuffer owne perſon thereby led according abilitie god giueth v ynough v helpe ſuch haue neede ayde muſt alſo hartie loue worde almes importeth much mercie men think haue done almes deed neyther regarde eſteeme perſon dog ſuffer part grief ſhort haue compaſsion prouided onely giue ſomwhat ſpeak properly almes truly witneſſe almes ſay mercie yet falſe witneſſe man hath ſayde compaſsion hartie affection ſpake let v marke well god alow life bee hard harted pitying ſuch aduerſitie therby moued ſuccor vttermoſt power deale ſo may well ſay gouerned god ſpirit life allowable true god commaundeth v many thing law neither ſaide one principall part yet notwithſtāding man may little angell reſidue worlde may haue admiration yet bee cruell wild beaſt ſo hardharted careth pore ſuch aduerſitie certa 〈…〉 god abhorre vertues might 〈…〉 eſtimation deſirous liuing cha 〈…〉 ly ſoberly yeelding euerie man right offering man wrong violence deceit deſirous ſay lord ſhould take theſe thing good worth doings ſhuld acceptable ſeruice vnto let mercie matched inſeparably like meates vnſauery without ſalt▪ ſo alſo pitifull relieue neighbor reach hād ſuch ſeeke ſuccor 〈…〉 god taketh neither taſt ſauor r 〈…〉 u ye ſee haue bear away text iob ſaith bliſſing readie periſh vpon hee bin father widow defender fatherleſse furthermore let v marke well according ſee want neceſsities neighbor ſo one ſhould ſay v behold ſhew would haue men communicate togither god could well ynough bring paſſe euery man ſhould contented owne perſon liue alone himſelf ſee none v al hath need others helpe ſpeake euen richeſt thoſe haue moſt eaſe let v take man helthful luſtie bodie hath ſtore good welth ſo ſhall ſeeme haue al thing liking yet notwithſtanding hath need men al mē cannot husbandman al men cannot clothier al mē cannot tanner ſo handicraft ſhort ſee god bindeth v one another force neceſsitie cheyne hold v faſt tied knit togither beſides ſee lord cōſtreineth v yet better ſendeth one man ſicknes another man pouertie one man another ſo rich priuileged poore oftentimes ſet ſuch perplexity know ſide turne v ſay god bringeth thē thither neuer thought euen ſay ſeeming world wil cauſe hereof ſayd afore god perceyuing men would ſet light one another euery one liue himſelfe poſsible draggeth v heare head ſheweth v ouergreat folly deſire exempt ſelues ſtate wherein hee hath ſet mankind therfore let v marke well neighbor wanteth according ſayd lame blinde ſuch readie periſhe widowes fatherleſse euery v ought cōſider go ought behaue ſelfe cace god haue giuen v wherwith bindeth v hand help ſuch want haue conſideration v diſappointing neighbor rob thing god hath ordeyned helpe muſt yeld account keping back thing god cōmitted vnto v vſe end ſuch want ſhould ſuccored let euery v conſider well abilitie giuen ſhal pay deare god gift beſtowed ought be▪ ſpecially cōſider • precious god ſight therevpon vſe purely cōmaundeth god gift ſo ſmal worthy eſtimation done apply right lawful vſe therfore god indueth man gift behoueth thinke ſelf alone true god haue vſe thanks giuing giuing alſo end ſhould haue wherwith helpe neighbor therefore muſt ſtreyne ſelf thervnto play niggard behalfe god cā wel ſhew ſteward good mine diſpoſe liſt dealing committed vnto vvherefore let euery man conſider wiſe god wil haue gift eſteemed let euery v ſo drinke owne water salomon ſayth riuers may flow forth neighbor let v play gluttōs ſelues alone let v haue ſuch ſpring may ſatisfie ſelues alſo releue ſuch wāt let v drink fountain god hath giuē v yet therwithal let v ſo deal men alſo may feele let v like wilde beaſtes thus yee ſee haue remember ſentence furthermore let v alſo marke ſide wee bee cruell verie neceſsity • themſelues ought moue v ſuccor neighbour truely though wee neyther lawe written prophet aught elſe nature hir ſelfe ſufficient good miſtreſſe bowe v ſoften hart ſee men neceſsitie beholde one man blynde another lame third lacketh goodes world another wanteth defence another hath neede counſell cace wee ſee owne fleſh prophet eſay ſayeth cannot renounce owne nature therefore ſee men made owne likeneſſe neceſsitie wee ſuccoure ill worſe brute beaſts let v bethinke ſelues may perchance alledge ignorāce excuſe v although one word teaching yet doth kynde ſelfe ſhew v blame worthy indeuer help ſuch ſo extremity heathē men beare ſufficiēt witneſſe nature man teacheth v behalfe aſmuch needefull yea euery one v ſufficiently conuinced experience ſee man aduerſitie certayne haue inſtinct motion within v ſo poſsible muſt needes runne thither what▪ euery v ſtoppeth eye turne backe plucke head coller ſome vayne trifling ſhift neuertheleſſe ſayd inward motion ſhall proces againſt v afore god haue indeuered help neceſsitie oure neighbor hath bin ſayd already wee muſte thinke men wanting ayde ſorte commeth caſual chaunce god hath appoynted faſhion end charitie might tried elſe wee might conuinced haue beene cruell iob addeth made inquiſition cace knowne vntoo bycauſe hee mynded know truth hande ſpeaketh hys owne priuate perſon one authoritie iuſtice haue ſeene afore poynt wel worthy noted ſuch office iuſtice ſheweth ought watchfull ſearching euery man right end ſuffer oppreſſed yet deceit wrōg true herevpon haue alſo generall doctrine gather firſt formoſt behoueth magiſtrates men authoritie knowe holy ghoſt intended ſhew leſſon giue ſure rule end might faithfully diſcharge dutie liſted bend themſelues contrariwiſe might left without excuſe diſcharge conteyned heere therefore let v marke well ynough iudge man wrong willingly pronounce ſentence according ſeeth alſo hee muſt diligent boulting thing inough iudge tary tyll men haue made way opē afore pointed matter finger muſt haue care ſpie thing himſelfe matter bee darke doubtfull muſt bend wit ende well informed ſuch diligence required iudges pray ſhall become ſhet eye willingly let thing paſſe fauour hatred bribe ſo caried away ſpoyle one man goodes fauor another man incumber third vvhat horrible damnation ſhal haue whē deale ſo therefore let v take good heede doctrine man intend ſerue god faythfully performe charge cōmitted vnto hym called office common welth muſt firſt vnderſtande hee ſet idoll good ſooth hath god promiſed giue ſpirit diſcretion king prince magiſtrates bycauſe haue neede ſingular gift aboue others therefore ſuche ſtate haue need pray vnto god ſo guide thē may haue ſuch wiſedome right vnderſtanding trye diſcern thing may wiſe deale vnaduiſedly ſo commended vnto god ſecond poynt diligent finde truth thing matter vnknowne vnto thē muſt thinke themſelues diſcharged ſaying knew nothing negligence ſhall coſt deare god therfore iudge intēdeth performe dutie muſt vigilant knowe thing go get inſtruction truth vttermoſt ſo much poſsible meanes hereby ſeene fond excuſe ſay wiſt yea men go enforme thē lye ſit god ſeat pray deceyued willingly bee contented ſift matter let miſcheef ſlip truly oftentimes ſhet eye fond ſhift occupie god roome god idol hath curteyn eies ſo cānot iudge betwene white black diſhonor ſuch iudges maſter wilfully ignorāt fal ſo aſlepe find hart men ſhould beguile thē beholde man hath worſt cace world goeth bleare iudges ſight ſhould caſt handfull aſhes eye ſet ſome let hys way iudge contented ſayth ſee awhit trayterouſneſſe god ſeat ought holy men go defile much villanouſe defiling lye men ſuffer thē peruert iudgemente right ſort peraduenture wil ſay reaſon reaſon ſtark lye thē iudges double minded men may bend thē like reedes wauer euery wind iudges like well ſo ſtedfaſtneſſe firmneſſe pray ſhall therfore ceaſſe guiltie god ſhall ſee many well eaſe men beguile deſire better haue ſome colour gloze alſo becomē thēſelues aduocates vntruthes fall foyſting lie ouerthrow right perchance ſome cace ſhal ſo throughly clere euē little child ſet could tell matter goeth according vnto truth yet iudges ſhall caſt wote doubtes cace ſhall bee true cleare ynoughe ſelfe one ſhall come alledge wote intangle matter iudges ſay tary til ſome proctor aduocate come bring lie lewd allegation turken whole cace themſelues ready ſay tuſhe thus thus cace ſhall good vtterly cleare euident yet notwithſtanding thruſt lye ſnarle intangle vtterly ſhort nothing bee ſeene ſo villaynous ſhameleſneſſe babe may iudge god nothing meane vvill hee ſuffer men ſcorne maieſtie ſorte defile ſacred ſeate whiche hee dedicated owne name wee ſee ſuche ſet ſeate iuſtice ſhall haue terrible account make dreadfull curſe prepared vnleſſe bee vigilāt ſearching thing ſo iudge aduē ture ne verefie prouerb ſayeth fooliſh iudge gyueth haſtie ſentence doo indeuer learne thing go ſo may always proteſt god alſo ſhew deedes afore men lette themſelues wer fully enformed truth matter knowne vnto negligence bee puniſhed ſo roughly ſuch haue drawne curteines ſcape hande god ſhal become thoſe euill conſcience corrupted bribe forepoſſeſſed parcialitie hatred fall flinging ſort like wilde beaſts ourthrowe muche lyeth inſomuch men know flee iuſtice refuge good plight among ſort eues pray come point ſhall appeare god although winke time ſee harder thing miniſter iuſtice ſeeing god requireth ſuch watchfulneſſe therwithall let v mark alſo euery mā particularly ſo much lieth ought make inquiry good euil end grieue neighbor although iudges pronounce publike ſentence yet notwithſtāding oftētimes neighbor wrong iudging amiſſe thē may harme many wayes want true information therefore let v ſet mind throughly try ſerch truth deceyued lying thereby wrong man furthermore iob hath treated wiſdom careleſnes ought men authoritie addeth vertue whiche requiſite thē ſay vncorruptneſſe cōſcience ſo ſet thēſe iues againſt wrong violence ſuffer outrage done mā without redreſsing much lieth cauſe iob proteſteth brake chawes wicked plucked pray frō betwene teeth cannot bee done vnleſſe iudges magiſtrates haue ſuch ſtoutneſſe thē cannot abide euill without reſiſting vertue alſo ſpeciall gift god although mā ſtout courage yet notwithſtāding whē ſeeth men fal many incōueniences purchaſing folk diſpleaſure plucketh backe cooleth true many example found yea euē among paynim thoſe whiche neuer knewe god bowed cauſe mainteyned right gaue hand ſuccour ſuche wrongfully oppreſſed man may wel ſee many example god worketh maner behalfe end take away excuſe frō thē pretend name haue ſwarued diſſembled ſuffred good men oppreſſed wronged wolues deuour ſheepe yet notwithſtanding ſayd afore thys vertue inuincible ſtoutneſſe cōſtancie ſpeciall gift god ſo ſet ſeate iuſtice haue deſired god giue wiſdome iudge rightly indeuered themſelues vttermoſt diſcharge duetie reach hand ſuch troden vnder foot ought ſet themſelues ſheeldes agaynſt ſuche woulde take away men good force ſet foot vpō pore men throtes iudges ought applie themſelues true men ſee wicked folke haue bridle lye looce neck body reſiſteth ſay cannot redreſſe ſuch excuſes purpoſe god ſee ſome men ſay man • eareth company drag behind behalfe would dutie ſhould ioyne leaue lewd fellow twain gren quake feare wote ſo fault woulde faine remedied cannot alone theſe reaſons may wel cary ſome colour men need muſt fal groūd god haue declared holy ghoſt giueth common leſſon ſuch haue charge committed vntoo leſſon muſte ſhew themſelues flat enemy wicked ſee ſo lyke madde beaſtes teeth ſharpned eate vp one byte another muſt barre doings ſtep employing againſt credite authoritie god hath giuen ſmall ſaying ſayd haue broken chawes wicked plucked pray teeth let v mark god ordeineth magiſtrates ſay calleth mē office iuſtice armeth thē ſword ſo bindeth maintein good innocent take vpon defence right alſo ſet themſelues againſt al wrong miſdealings violence iudge ſay know right wrong blame firſt god neuer faile giue wiſdome ſuch aske alſo bliſſe labor trauell faithfully ſeeke right iudges ſo farre frō making inquiſition ſuch oppreſſed men ſo complayne vnto ayre ſhall ring yet notwithſtanding meane eares ſuch ought ſet hand remedie deafe mā haue paciently put vp wrong iudge made priuie cace excuſed cannot ſay came complayne fault committed thine eye thyne office redreſſe thou haſt made account thinkeſt thou eſcape cleere god yee ſhall ſee poore folke complaine come ſhew right yet haue redreſſe cōtrariwiſe euil hath bin done ſword muſt drawne matter muſt hādled vehemencie mad •• n ſay zeale iuſtice much purpoſe vilanouſe ſhameleſneſſe wherein neyther rime reaſon ſuffer poore man troubled meane deale rigour may matter nothing poore man wronged comp • ayn lay foorth right tuſh nothing come againe ſeuennight hence ſhall delayed ſo long ſhal tired plaine man haue rent reuenues liue vpon haue men beck ſolicite matter handicraft man hee muſt ſterue hunger hee recouer right matter neuer ſo euident hath wrong done worlde ſeeth matter apparantly knowne yet ende hee haue right muſt hee haue full purſe muſt ſhet vp ſhop muſt make account idle halfe yeare hath folowed hys matter good yet ſhall laughed ſcorne vve ſee diſorder day therefore make account afore god placed holy ſeate iuſtice true cleare thēſelues men yet ſhall thys doctrine diſanulled ſo ſayde ofward thing inquiſitiue ſith ſee thing brought light zeale ſuccor thoſe ſo miſuſed oppreſſed yea alſo ſene wicked becom bolder euen reaſon libertie giuen whē ſhal haue committed euill ſcape vnpuniſhed al one libertie priuiledge giuen harme men vvell vſe abuſe therevpon proceede meane iudge ſtill ſay indeede ſuche euill committed yea happened ſecond third fourth inſomuch length order yet meane redreſſe vvill god haue ſeate honored except ſayd vertue ſtoutneſſe conſtancie repreſſe euill therefore bee ſuch libertie wicked ſort may play lion beares wood beaſts let ſuch authoritie god remember themſelues ought ſerue maiſter ſhall diſcharge ſelfe dutie ſhall haue ſide ſhall vphilde hys hande ye ſee wherevpon iudge ought thynke ſhall hee haue lion heart ſet himſelfe againſt woodde beaſtes plucke pray teeth breake theyr chawes good faith let v mark theſe maner ſpeeches ſuperfluous effect iob rather holy ghoſte mouth ment declare ſuch execute iuſtice duly ſhall neuer bring paſſe except vſe ſword god hath put hande breake chawes wicked ſay except vſe ſharpneſſe rigor iudge effeminate whē commeth puniſhing offender fall ſaying wote wote ſay ſo deſtitute ſtoutneſſe redreſſe matter order certayne hee ſhall neuer performe hys dutie therefore whereas heere mention made breaking wicked men teeth let v vnderſtād lord warneth thoſe whome hath giuen ſworde vſe ſtoutly againſt wicked whiche commonly ouerhardy like brute beaſts ſo iuſheers also muſt haue ſtedfaſt ſtout heart repreſſe violence rage thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne concluſion let v marke ſentence iob ſetteth downe whiche hee clothed himſelfe rightuouſneſſe hadde made iuſtice ſay vprightnes robe crowne ſaye hee decked vertue brauerie thoſe bee whome god hath aduaunced ſome credite beare themſelues hande world worthy looke face play peacockes ſpread wing abroade ye ſee decking thoſe day authoritie ſtate iuſtice nothing bee ſeene pride nothing pompe brauerie yet thinke themſelues bee mortall men contrariwiſe ſayde heere man regardeth god indeuereth execute duty faythfully taketh rightuouſneſſe robe vpright dealing cloake apparell pray honeſtie ſake woulde man ſuffer coate cloake bee plucked himſelfe bee ſent picke pagles prouerbe ſayeth neyther whote colde woulde keepe cloathes ſtill intent might honeſtly keepe company among men man bee ſtripped chaunce bee rayne winde ſo hee left readie ſtarue colde ſwelt heate coate pluckt peeces greeue hart yet notwithſtanding rightuouſneſſe vpright dealing verie cloathes coates bee apparayled man haue behaued himſelfe faythfully dooing duetie god mainteyneth hee fenced protection aboue hee ſhall bee god fauour although man made good countenance among men yee ſee ſort wee ought cloathed apparelled god angel namely keeping ſaid rightuouſneſſe vpright dealing ſo wee haue beene ſpoyled deſtitute although diuerſe tymes either flatterie briberie threatning hatred ſome temptation men labour get away clothing apparell rightuouſneſſe vpright dealing v let v take good heede bee ſpoyled except wee haue ſhame diſhoneſtie ſhewed openly god angelles furthermore touching worlde preſent life let v bee well ware lay ſelues open cold heate ſaye god ſuffer v fall intoo many wantes therewithall ſende v ſuccour wee haue beene ſo cowardely ſlouthfull ſuffer ſelues bee ſpoyled oure cloathes good reaſon wee ſhoulde ſmarte afterwarde cloake couer keepe mee rayne haue let goe aduenture nowe woorthie bee wette skinne ſeeing hilde ſcorne caſt cloake mee beholde god declareth vnto v intent wee ſhoulde bee well clad hee himſelfe hath cloathed v owne rightuouſneſſe wee caſt away rightuouſneſſe thing value make account ſayd vpright dealing equitie hee commendeth ſo greatly vnto v wee caſt away wynd seeing wee vnclothe ſelues ſort pray deſerue oure lorde ſhould gyue v vp ſhame mocked skorned therewithall bee left vtterly deſtitute thing finally haue ayde ſuccour neyther god man lo wee haue marke text truly wee neuer diſcharge ſelues throughly duetie meane onely magiſtrates haue ſo highe harde charge alſo haue gouern themſelues theyr houſholdes vnpoſsible ſhoulde haue ſuche perfection bee garniſhed wyth rightuouſneſſe vpright dealing poyntes vvhat haue wee doo vvee muſte reſort oure lorde ieſus chriſt twoo cauſes firſt wee finde ſelues thing conteyned heere bee ſlowe vntoo goodneſſe ſwift vntoo euill neyther wiſedome diſcretion v therefore behoueth v drawe ieſus chriſt ſpirite wiſedome ſtrength gyuen ſayde eleuenth chapter prophete eſay wee bee clothed rightuouſneſſe oure lorde ieſus chryſt vprightneſſe wiſedome giue v holy ſpirite ſhall wee bee garniſhed decked conueniently appeare god foraſmuch preſent life alwayes bee ſome imperfection v ſo alwayes bee amſſe lorde ieſus chriſt muſte meere grace couer faultes ſo may pardoned hys ſake hee ſupplie wantes therewithall continually increaſe giftes holy ſpirite v guide v power ſame vntill hee haue cleare ridde v infirmity corruption fleſh bee come marke wherevnto going nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v ſo feele vtterly diſmayd ſelues wee may make recourſe vnto hym truſting ſame ſhall bee vayne bycauſe hee willing ready help ſeeke ſo let v ſay almighty god heauenly father c cvij sermon fourth vpon xxix chapter 18 ſayd ſhall dye neſt ſhall multiplie dayes ſande 19 roote ſpread vvater deavve ſhall lye vppon harueſt ſhall bee verie great 20 glorie ſhall renued bovve ſhall ſtrengthned hande 21 men heard vvith longing hilde toung counſell 22 replyed vvordes talke dropped rayne vpon hearer 23 vvayted deavv opened mouth deſired rayne 24 laughed vvith beleeued neyther ſuffered lyght countenaunce fall 25 vvhen came vvay chief roome vvas among king vvith armie comforter mourned iob hauing ſpoken authoritie purchaſed hys vertues gift grace god putte doth nowe adde ſeemed ſtate ſhoulde neuer haue chaunged therein ſheweth like thoſe reigne ouer mē whether wil alwayes doubt vncertaintie according ſee ſuch attain honour authoritie wrōgfully may well beare great ſway make world quake vnder aſſoone winde turneth leaſt chaunge world ouerthroweth vvhy ſo bee feared ſo hated ſuche crouch creepe wiſh hart ſee ouerthrowne ſhort haue foundation iob ſheweth hee fleeting credit ſhould continue two three day ſo well grounded man might haue ſayde ſtate ſhould neuer haue beene chaunged ſo well vnderpropped ſides lo meenig yet notwithſtanding god ſmote ſuch wiſe hee became miſerableſt creature world therefore maruell though hee ſuche anguiſh hee coulde hee fell intoo aduerſitie hee neuer looked cauſe hee ouerſhootes himſelfe oftentimes hys talke althoughe haue alwayes eye vntoo god yet hee exceſsiue tootoo muche therefore muſte bee thought ſtraunge conſidering myſerie whyche hee indured incomprehenſible ſuche one men neuer thought afore muſt ſerue oure learning wee may alwayes ſtande vpon gard god ſende v proſperitie let v bee ſleepie lette v conſider thys mortall life ſubiect chaunges deuiſe yea truly notwithſtanding proppes wee haue although whole worlde ſeeme fauour v wee haue hundred thouſande ſhoulders beare v vp yet muſt neuertheleſſe thinke ſettledneſſe heere bylow thing tranſitorie ſo thinges chaunged turning hande thoſe lifted higheſt vp caſt loweſt downe beholde ſay leſſon haue gather thys texte needefull doctrine v nothing eaſier man make himſelfe beleeue hee ſhall alwayes continue happie ſtate vvee ſee dauid hymſelfe confeſſeth vvhen proſperitie ſayeth ſayd ſhall neuer remoued true tenth pſalme putteth ouer deſpizers god ſpeaking theyr proſperitie ſayeth beare themſelues hande although whole world ſhoulde bee turned vpſide downe yet ſo exceedingly well fenced ſhall continue ſafe ſtill yee ſee worldling vnbeleeuers preſume vpon owne power take themſelues ſo wel armed ſides nothing may hurt according alſo holy scripture ſpeaketh pride dauid owne perſon forealledged text thirtith pſalme ſayeth fell aſleepe ſince time god ſettled kingdome made proſper giuen vpper hand enemy therevpon made reckening neuer remoue ſtate ſayeth hee lorde thou haſt well taught experience fauor thy good aduaunced maner ſoone felt thy hand behold ſuch plight vtterly wit end dauid ſheweth euen child god althoughe bee puffed vp pride vnbeleuers ſo • themſelues good fortune terme notwithſtanding able ſtay frō promiſing thēſelues needefull imagine good dayes ſhall laſt euer proſperitie ſhall neuer fayle sith inclined ſuche vice inſomuche euen dauid altogither clere haue elſe take heede ourſelues ſort dauid marking vice doth alſo ſhew remedie whē ſayth lord ſureneſſe ſafetie kingdome grounded vpon thine goodneſſe acknowledge welfare dependeth vppon god good pleaſure wee ſhall conclude certaintie ſettledneſſe ſelues let v call vpon god wayte hande whatſoeuer ſhall pleaſe ſend v although wee hope hee continue goodneſſe towardes v yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſſe prepare oure ſelues whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe meeken v exerciſe pacience aduerſitie let v alwayes bee readineſſe thinke ſtraunge commeth furthermore letvs marke well howe dauid ſayth troubled one ſhould come vpon man faſt aſleepe vvill like trouble hand god ſtriketh v let v diſpoſe ſelues aforehand lette v preuent change ſeene eye god ſheweth v ende euery v ſhould keepe good watch thus ye ſee ſay doctrine whiche conteyned heere neceſſary v muſt thinke dye neſt manner ſimilitude iob vſeth heere muſt bird vppon bough remoue god pleaſure inriched wee may impoueriſhed liſt haue bin great honour eſtimation may come ſuch reproch ſhame maneral whole world may mocke v pleaſure▪ wee may take good woorth ſayd readineſſe hand end bee troubled lord ſhall viſite v maner haue ſpeciall neede warned heereof bycauſe ſtate chriſtians chaungeable paule ſayth himſelfe fellowes without reſt vſeth word ought conſtant behoueth v determine ourſelues neuer ſwarue touching outward viſible ſtate worldward muſt faine fleeting without reſt ſeeing god hath called v thervnto let euery one v take heed make hys reckening without hoſt ne beare himſelf hand ſhall continue alwayes one ſtate hee warranteth himſelfe cannot performe behold heere two thing haue marke one proſperitie ſoeuer haue ſame certayne abiding ſtate ſo good pleaſure god lyke prince ſhould gyue man poſſeſsion ſome lordſhip feeſimple holde tenant hath day day prince may reuoke hys graunt pleaſeth hym like cace thinges god giueth v thys worlde condition ſhould inioy life deathe onely pleaſeth hym according alſo hee knoweth expedient v lo firſt point ſeconde poynt muſt conſider good god remoue v time tyme ſo long world ſhould ſuffer v ſettle long ſurely would gather ruſt drawe muche ſuperfluous baggage v god therefore remoueth v ſaye hee chaungeth ſtate▪ hee afflicteth v hee maketh v poore hath lifted v vp hee caſteth v downe ende ſhoulde bee ſnarled good thys world become ſo fooliſh keepe way continually heauenly life thus ye ſee haue beare away texte furthermore let euery v inure himſelfe conſider turning wee ſee world lorde ſheweth v intent wee ſhoulde fare better ſpecially wee ſee thyng neuer miſtruſted looked afore ſome man aduaunced
