great credit nothing went againſt wind weather ſay ſo hee ſhall haue gathered great rich gotten great freends haue alied hymſelfe well gotten infinit ſtayes wee ſee ſuch one fall bycauſe god layeth hand vpon beate hym downe▪ let v think ourſelues behoueth v wake god declareth vnto v ther nothing certaine world ende ſhould come hide ſelues vnder wing alſo diſpoſe ſelues aduerſitie whenſoeuer ſhal pleaſe ſend happen fall let v much aſtonied diſmayde bycauſe haue minded long time hande▪ verely ſometimes god maketh alteration onely vpon men▪ alſo vpon city countries▪ kingdom vvhen theſe great courtier ſuch reputation mē thought aduanced aboue clowdes ſeene come decay chaunge ryght great woonderfull ſee citie shire yea reahn ouerthrown ſayd afore man would haue thought bin ſo muche help beene vnpoſsible haue come vnto ſay ſee ouerthrowne let v vnderſtand lord ſetteth looking glaſſe eye end euery v ſhoulde thinke better vppon owne frailtie fall aſleepe preſumption vayne truſt thus ye ſee ought profit oure ſelues text experience lord giueth v life long iob vſeth mo ſimilitudes expreſſe ſayde ſay deaw ſhall lye alwayes vpon harueſt vpon braunches hebrewe woorde importeth twayn commeth one end againe dayes ſhall multiplyed ſand hee ſhoulde ſaye without number againe glory ſhall renued bow ſhall beaten true ſome men vnderſtand theſe ſayings concerne hope reſurrection men may ſee whole proces matter iob treateth ſtate preſent lyfe therefore muſt climb ſo hye ſeeke ſo curious gloze content ſelues naturall ſenſe haue ſet downe already whiche iob meeneth heere ſay ſtate well ſettled ſo men thought euer ſhould haue ſeene fall intoo ſo miſerable plight ſayd circumſtance make many men wonder whē ſee ſuch change fall reaſoning ourſelues happeneth god thundereth vppon ſo hye mountaynes ſmiteth ſo great head poſsible conſider god intendeth vtter power cace end men ſhoulde truſt ſo muche themſelues learne referre themſelues wholly vnto reſt altogithervpon goodneſſe promiſe themſelues thing owne imagination much behoueth v marke wel circumſtance iobs aduauncement onely day two three ſome ſhort time hee ſeemed vtterly exempted danger perill misfortune yet notwithſtanding god ſmote ſo roughly vpon hys hand vtterly defaced vvherefore let v vnderſtand god ment giue v notable looking glaſſe heere end ſhould always kepe good watch whē haue called vpō god pleaſe ſend v affliction might receiue paciētly inaſmuch ſort forſene ſurely whatſoeuer vertu v ſame muſt ſtir v vp whē ther hapneth change muſt vnderſtād according lord hath giuen v gracious gift ſpecially ſhal haue gouerned v holy ſpirit vſe thē well becommeth v ſame muſt ſerue ſtabliſh v pacientneſſe notwithſtanding weakened yea vtterly beaten body let v aſſure ourſelues god come vtter ſtrength ſpirit ſuſtcining v end may fight againſt ſuch temptation victory ſhall haue gotten may ſo much glorious bycauſe goodneſſe hath bin increaſed towards v lo heere wee haue marke iob goeth matter dealt great authoritie hee gotten vain reputatiō wiſdom grauitie bicauſe ſo gouerned himſelf euery man reuerēced therfore ſayth expreſly al mē herkned yea berkned ſuch ſort waited word euery man gaped man athirſt ſee earth dry doth crany ſo deſired rain drinke iob declareth himſelfe ſuch one wit hee rain deaw ſuch heard altered word hung vpon talke vpō vnreuocable iudgement declared vntoo v purpoſely end ſhould know firſt mā iob ſee ſo ſore ſmitten god hand therefore let v complayne grudge againſt god accuſe cruelty afflicteth v ſee iob gayned namely abode vanquiſhed cō founded whē went ſtriue againſt chaſtizementes god ſent yet neuertheleſſe ye ſee holineſſe life perfection hym therfore let v learn god always iuſt afflicting v compare ourſelues iob ſhal find ourſelues far ſhort perfectiō yet beaten ſharply thē haue none ſhift receyue god ſtripes wyth lowlineſſe pacience marke one point herewithal ſee iobs perſon reuerēce ought beare ſuch god ſendeth teach v faythfully ſayd men hearkened longing wherein ſheweth mē ought haue deſire profit knowledge ſeing nature prouoketh thē deſire eate drinke nouriſhment body muſt deſpiſe foode ſoules whiche knowledge lerning goodneſſe wherby differ brute beaſts vvhē know thing good mainteine v neede neither maſter teacher teach v couet neither need prouocation body put v mind euery man ſayd skil couet eate drinke euery man deſire bee clothed vvhy ſo know thoſe thing cōcerne life ſoule excellenteſt part v ought interteyned eating drinking thing agreeable nature haue reaſon vnderſtanding life brutiſh may ſhew ourſelues creature formed image god verſe ſhewed v blockiſh leaſtwiſe haue reaſon v wee oughte cōtinually deuiſe may profit knowing end man borne world namely ſtabliſhed knowledge god wee haue receyued wee ſee many ſo retchleſſe paſſe heare thing ſee otherſom cannot ſatisfied diſpiſing doctrin alſo hate vtterly abſent thēſelues aſmuche cā ſuch folk deſerue counted men thing wherin wee differ brute beaſtes haue ſome reaſon vnderſtanding v diſcerne betwene good euil yet notwithſtanding ther ſuch groſnes infirmitie wit haue neede furtherance yea though wee al furtherance could wiſhed yet apparant ſtill default v cauſe wee reiect benefites god offereth v bycauſe bee woiſe beaſts wee muſt needes conclude man knew ende creation hee liueth world would always moued profit knowledge ſet mind therevpon hee would neuer refuſe meanes whē offred would think himſelf behold god intendeth teach therfore behoueth yeelde ſelfe willing learne giue eare doctrine ſetteth afore good auailable ſaluation lo deſire ought v let v looke vpon oure owne retchleſneſſe god ſo gracious vnto v giue v word ſendeth v ſome man hath good wit vnderſtanding alſo willing duty maſter himſelfe although hee come downe heauen owne viſible perſon yet haue law prophet goſpel giue v infallible aſſurance record ſpeaketh ſeing god openeth holy mouth teache v although hee vſe mortall men inſtruments pray vnthākfull vouchſafe profit ſchoole yet neuertheleſſe ſee fare behalfe vvherfore behoueth v remember well leſſon ſhewed heere reſpect god vpbraydeth v according alſo ieſus chriſt hath done iewes hypocrite ſaying cā skill diſcerne ſeaſons tell sunne cheere earth know weather cleare fayre ſo may go buſineſſe diſcerne whiche belongeth oure ſoules bicauſe much wedded thys preſente life none v wiſheth raine knoweth needefull ſaying nowe good earth watered agayne haue neede heate faire weather thing elſe wee ſo good skill forecaſt thing cōcerne commodity temporall life lacke al v behalfe behold god ſendeth v word know due time viſitation enter whē gate opened v hee calleth v ſides wee take ſcorne come furthermore let v marke well ſimilitude ſet downe without cauſe iob ſayeth word wiſhed wayted raine deaw moyſes alſo vſeth ſame ſong ye heauens ſaith let wordes drop deaw raine ſeaſon vnderſtanding hereof muſt conſider raine ſelfe alſo marke vſe profit bringeth v rain ſome reſpect may hurtfull vnto wet hard skin go abrode feelds men alſo keepeth within doores yet ſeaſonable rayne bringeth v ſuſtenance moyſting earth whiche could yeeld frute without thus ye ſee rayne deſired ſo let v vnderſtand wee oure part muche barreyn earth proofe heereof bryng foorth nothing ſhrewd weedes true reſpect euil fruteſtil reſpect good cannot bring foorth ſo muche one grayne corne one braunch good herb much leſſe wee bryng foorth one good nouriſhing frute wherewith feede ſelues ſhoote foorth one blade good corne vntil god haue chaunged nature hath god put good v muſt alſo faine water elſe bee either choked briar elſe grow wilde lorde muſt worke behalfe beholde meane intendeth keepe ſendeth v word raine ende beeing ſo moyſtned wee maye ſee woorking cheerefulneſſe good roote hath planted v may periſh increaſe bud bring foorth good frute furthermore let v take heede become like ſtones blockes god rayneth ſo vppon v rain doth earth good well tilled good rock none rayne loſt vpon euē ſo men well tilled minded yeelde vnder obedience oure god maketh word raine vpon v certenly enter hart ſhal feele working ſo ſhal diſpoſed vnto goodneſſe good work ſhal ſhewe haue bin watered vayne god minde grace ſhould loſt v continue alwayes oure curſed nature many men wilfull froward ſhall like rock hee raine vpon v vvee ſhall haue diſpoſition receyue raine coſt v right deere therefore let v vnderſtand raine god ſending haue worde preached vnto v ſtreameth downe vpon v make vaniſh aire ſuffer light vpon ground may ſure ſuch vnthankfulneſſe ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed thus ye ſee end behoueth v apply ſimilitude iob vſeth heere ſayth wordes wayted longed rayne deawe wit muſt aſſure ourſelues good doctrine whiche god ſendeth vnto v oure welfare commeth v heauen although heare mortall man hand yet notwithſtādyng god ſending ye ſee god deſire water v intent make v receyue good ſeede hand bring foorth good frute according added heere iob ſayth hys word longed wayted alſo men receiued immediatly greate earneſt good alſo replying cō trary pleaſe god teach v thereof raiſe vp meete men induced grace holy ſpirit vnder whome wee may profite let v giue eare reuerence yeeld theyr good doctrine without conſtraint true ought examine ſpirits wee muſt aduenture receyue doctrine ſet afore v vntill wee ſure god knowe god ſpeaketh ſay wee ſure taught hys name mouth replying wee muſt doo honoure ſettle ourſelues fully vpon word ſo may yeld ourſelues obediēt vnto may haue full courſe authoritie among v true many find hart ſuffer god ſpeake without kicking againſt ſo know thing bee good preached vnto yet doo ſtriue againſt life thing wherein lord intendeth trie whether haue wee heard god word vve muſt reply againſt muſt glorify god aſſuring ſelues nothing better v obey haue acknowledged let euery v retourned intoo oure houſes ſhewe oure deedes wee haue borne away doctrine alow good doth contrary whyche confeſſeth double condemnable ſurely bee folke doo muche woorſe ſecrete wickedneſſe opened worlde alſo theyr replying againſte god extendeth onely mouth alſo lyfe therefore folke lyue taught goſpell work replye ſufficiently agaynſte god vvhen man troubleth neighboure ſo riſeth vp openly againſt doth violence certayne ſuche outrage ſhall bee borne withall ſhall puniſhed god hande howe long ſo euer hee tarrie although oure going anoy neighbour ſuttle tie vndermining ſo ſlights bee cheefly conueyed couered cannot reproued men nother man ſeeming finde fault v yet notwithſtanding crye mounteth vp heauen craueth vengeance god hand extortion haue ſo committed ſecret vvherefore let v marke well although haue yeelded ſuch reuerence vnto god word heare good holy doctrine receiue foode ſoules meane bring v euer laſting life ſaluation pretend deſire yet behoueth euery one v take good heede hymſelfe hee replye agaynſt hys life nowe let v conſider little man may euer find vertue world behold iob ſpeaketh ſuch time god doctrine yet darke well knowne whither liued law moyſes howbeit certayne hee auncienter prophet ſpoken prophet hee ſpoken man bin auncient time ſeeyng ſo pray ought world day giuen receiue god doctrine tyme haue ſayde doctrine god darke thoſe dayes god ſent drop drop euen ther falleth ſmall deaw night bee ſhorte men taught ſlightly compariſon abundance grace god ſendeth worlde theſe dayes goſpell haue infinite treaſures wiſdome knowledge god ſheweth hymſelfe familiarly vntoo v haue v filled throughly filled wyth perfection doctrine giueth ſo cleere certayne vnderſtanding poſsible yet reuerence iob ſpeaketh deſire amiable obedience▪ nay contrariwiſe ſee skornefulneſſe haue touched already againe doctrine preached many giue attentiue eare vnto nay moſt parte buſied theyr owne fancy earthly care haue wote matter within ſhut god dores ſo play reſty iades kicking againſt doctrine theyr comming sermon faſhion ſake returne home wiſe went thither fewe folke whome reuerence founde ſpoken heere conforming themſelues fully vnto rare vertue euery man wiſe cunning ſort obeying god comming knowledge holy ſcripture nay mary ſay thynke thus thus ſeemeth men aſhamed alledge theyr weenings god cheefe article fayth papiſts day opinion god ought ſet greate ſtore thys theyr ouerdiueliſh pride would haue men holde themſelues deuiſes blaſpheme ſo openly theyr mouthes neuertheleſſe ſeene theyr deedes rebell agaynſte god wee ſee howe god doth nowadayes ſet whole perfection wiſedome goſpell commeth ſo familiarly vnto v deſiring fill v full yet notwithſtanding wee finde taſt hys worde vtterly deſpiſe declared vnto v wee go reſiſt leaſtwiſe deface doings seeyng ſo maliciouſe ſhall heare iob beare witneſſe againſt v shall vpbrayde v wyth obedience whiche yeelded vnto iob deede prophete god yet ſuche recorde calling oure lorde ieſus chriſt hathe giuen thoſe preache goſpell theſe dayes therefore let v marke well thys texte like ſayd leaſt kingdome heauen ſaye preache goſpell theſe dayes excellent miniſterie iohn baptiſt prophet ſo contrary parte deſpiſe doctrine god ſendeth ſeeing commaundeth ſo honoured certayne ſhall double giltie thus ye ſee haue marke thys text ſayd immediatly iob iested beleeued vvhereby meeneth hee ſuche grauitie men durſt beleeue hee woulde ieſt bycauſe conuerſation ſhewed himſelfe prophete god gotten ſo greate credite reuerence whiche men beare vnto cauſe men thought hee would abace himſelfe become fellow like companion others afterward hee addeth conſtreyned let light countenance fall ſay compelled hyde cheerefull countenance bycauſe although glad ſee yet durſt ſhew like countenance againe feare offending manner way ſerueth confirme matter ſpoken already holy ghoſt ſheweth v looking glaſſe reuerence whole people thoſe dayes towards man indued excellent giftes notwithſtanding ſame ſpirite reſted ſpeaketh day vnto v men honored ſuch wiſe durſt ſhewe like countenance laughhed feare diſpleaſing ſheweth well obedience wee ſhould yeelde god worde wee ought eſteeme honoure doctrine much wee knowe proceedeth oure welfare herewithall iob ſheweth alſo ſort behaued ſelfe among thoſe honoured ſo gaue cheefe roome vnto king namely bene comforter afflicted therefore hee ſheweth parte hee abuſed authoritie giuen taking vpon lorde manner falſe prophetes according ſayde ezechiell whiche vſe ſuche extreme ſterneneſſe though woulde ſet feete vpon neckes thoſe feare god thundering ſtorming againſt meane haue humanitie regarde reach hand ſuch afflicted iob declareth grauitie tvrantlike ſaye ſturdie ſtatelyneſſe daunt poore folke make afraid although hee ſhewed himſelfe familiar yet ſtoode awe durſte dallie bycauſe knewe receiued god ſpirit abundantly vvherefore let v vnderſtand like bin milde courteous vnto al men ſo alſo leſſon thoſe whome god hath called teaching neyghbors generally faythfull euery man owne behalfe god giue v authoritie ſo repleniſhe v holie ſpirite wee honoured among men v aduaunce ourſelues ouerrule like lord abuſing god giftes wreſting cleane contrarie meening behoueth v knowe oure lorde imployeth v comforting poore afflicted wit ſuche ſeeke ſerue god lowlineſſe may cheered hearing ſeeing vs▪ like god worde hated wicked ſort deſpizers thereof bicauſe telleth deſtruction ſo alſo caſt ſelues aduaunced pryde preſumption ſtubbornneſſe always lowly minded ſhort ſcholers ieſus chriſt muſt need cheered doctrine according ſaying come vnto mee yee labour heauie loden refreſh let ſuch haue charge vtter god word loke well make doctrine carrie found ſweete amiable ſuch oppreſſed ouerwhelmed ſelues knowledge owne wantes miſeries therewithall▪ deale roughly let towards thoſe haue need roughly handled tamed reaſon hardneſſe nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledging ſinnes praying hee hath made v perceyue alſo giue v ſuche repentance wee may hartely deſire healed remedy hee ſendeth v much worde true medicine purge oure diſeaſes make ſame worke effectually hee hath giuen v health hee feede v ſelfeſame foode ſtrengthen v therby ſo may ſhewe effect howe liueth v therefore may liue worlde fleſhe notwithſtanding dwell liuing may feed ſoules worde vntill hee haue called v intoo kingdome heauen angel wee ſhall neede teaching haue meanes whiche requiſite oure infirmitie nowe maye pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c cviij sermon first vpon xxx chapter novve mocke mee vvhich yonger vvhoſe father haue refuſed ſet vvith dogges flocke 2 vvhereto ſtrength handes ſerue ſeeing age vvas periſhed 3 deſtitute meanes dearth famine fled place vvas ſolitiarie dark deſolate vvaſte 4 cut vp vveedes tree iuniper roote vvas meate 5 vvere chaſed among men men ſhouted theefe 6 dvvelt cleft riuers caues earth rockes 7 roared among tree gathered themſelues togither vnder buſhes 8 child fooles yea child vvithoute renoume vvere brought lovver earth 9 novv ſong matter talke vpon 10 abhorre flee farre forbeare ſpit face haue ſeene honoure wherein iob bene time reherſing ende comparing reproche wherein hee hee might ſhewe howe cauſe bee ſad intollerable greefe ſee himſelfe ſcorned extremitie euen thoſe feared ſtood awe afore nowe man hath beene aduaunced great honour hyghe eſtate afterwarde ſeeth himſelfe deſpized naturall thing bee greeued thereat looketh vpon thing left vpon excellent ſtate whence hee falne poore man ſhall haue liued home countrie neuer taſted honoure pompe alwayes poynt ſelfe menne ſcorne diſdayne ſhewe token contempt towardes perſon good men alſo ſhall haue lyued ſimplicitie bee ſo greatly greeued ouerpaſſe hath bene brought vp pleaſure hath aboundance rich abyde ſhame without deadly wounding heart bicauſe men hilde ſome eſtimation althoughe men come ſpyte face yet bee anye crooked dealing tendeth ſhaking contempte greeueth ſore yee ſee howe naturall thing ſuch haue bin honour vnable beare owne defacing bee greued thing iob declareth heere like declared reuerence men bere vnto ſo much men gaue eare reſpecte rich bycauſe god giuen wiſedome diſcretion aboue menne ſo might reſt vpon hee mirroure pattern al vertue take example whole life nowe ſawe himſelfe ſcorned euerie man pointed finger croſſe much heauier bitterer beare neuer bene aduaunced heretofore heereof haue good leſſon gather commonly man noozeled pleaſure therby waxeth ouertender ſo much profite ſo brought vp honoure ſo men ſhoulde neuer diſpleaſe v ſpeake thing v ſhoulde rather tickle eare ſcratch vvhy ſo knowe lord commendeth v aboue thing pacient acknowledge faultes bee blamed face men yeelde v honoure rather ſcorne v let ſame put v mynde haue honoured god whome honour belongeth therefore good reaſon wee ſhould receyue ſuch reward ſhame vpon head god intendeth trie lowlyneſſe behalfe oure meeke receyuing iniuries men doe vnto v withoute ſtomaking delicate bringing vp v pleaſure ſayde cauſeth v vnpacient ſo wee beare thing ſoone man doth poynte v finger greeueth v yea ſuch corzie v wee wote whiche way turne v lorde inure v ſuffering wrong • nd reproches let v learne therin procureth welfare profite intent ſhould bee whole ſounde ſay cauſe sainte paule ſaith behoueth v armed ſides may paſſe ſhame reproch well honour god liſt haue v eſtimination let v therevpon gather▪ ſhall alwayes continue ſtate nother let v ſotte ſelues vaine glorie ambition let v vnderſtand lord bindeth v ſo much vnto good edifying neyghboures vvhen man preheminence hee ought conſider men looke vppon lorde hath ſet candle cubbard table giue light therefore ſtandeth hande walke carefully beware hee giueth occaſion ſtumbling vnto man thus yee ſee howe honoure god gyueth v ought bee applyed oure vayne glorie edifying oure neyghbours ſide alſo let v marke howe saint paule ſaith behoueth v throughly acquainted reproches haue eares beaten men ſlaunder v let v neuertheleſſe take good woorth yet notwithſtanding let v take good heede ſcoffing v may fault furthermore conſcience bee cleere god ſo wee ſure raile vpon v backbite v malice without cauſe let v put ouer wholly vnto god contente ſelues allowance therewithal ſaid let v vtterly inured thervnto long time hād lewde thing men ſo tender haue eares ſo nice able beare miſreport thus yee ſee haue marke text muche doctrine harde practize let v alſo marke example giuen v scripture behold dauid take man renoumed among others bin king continued ſuche proſperitie openly ſeene god guided hand aduanced worldly mean owne pollycie ſuche ſorte god meent ſhewe ſpeciall working owne power bene ſo honored behold afflicted turning hande yea owne ſonne stone throwne heade semei owne ſubiect perſecuted deede word ſpited ſaying thou murtherer thou receyueſt thy payment vvherein vpbraideth god ſente reward due cruelty hee committed againſt houſe saule neuertheleſſe dauid might well haue beene inflamed anger againſte semei ſpecially conſidering circumſtances wee haue touched ſawe owne ſubiecte bend ſelfe openly againſt beeing ſo excellent renoumed king firſte formoſt calleth mynde god whiche exalted yea hee done owne meere grace whereas nowe caſt downe ſame came caſualtie miſfortune god wil would haue bayted men god ſaith hath appoynted ſo semeis outrage pride allowed god bicauſe dauid knew ſame came paſſe without heuenly prouidēce therfore hū bleth ſelfe furtherance heereof booted greatly hee beene brought vp poore countrey cloyne ſheepeheard netehearde wyth father youth hee kepte father lambes brought vp ſo dayntily knowe beſcorned bringing vp therfore greatly profite heere yee ſee ſayde god ſhould waken v rather ſuffer v bee alwayes flattered men would bee oure behoofe vvherefore let v vnderſtand men vſe ſuch miſſayings raylings againſt vs▪ god doth meanes prepare v ende ſhoulde ſtrange • v hee liſted nowe abace v nowe ſuch extremity betide v lorde prepareth v pacience therevpon let v marke example dauid man ſubiect paſsions wee bee yet notwithſtanding ſubmitteth himſelfe wiilingly perceiued bee god hee ſhould bee torne peeces yea though wrongfully matter muſt greeue v rather muſt bee good cheere conſciences aunſwereth well v god wee knowe men perſecute v wrongfully ſaye thing ought vphold v better muſt ſo fooliſhe ſay nowe cauſe men find ſcorne ſort true wee reproched oure ſinnes ſake ſame ought frame v ſo much vnto pacience lord ſuffer v ſlandered ſcorned whē notwithſtanding wee ſhall haue liued well haue giuen occaſion wicked backbiter doe v iniurie let v aſſure ourſelues lord hath graunted v ſingular grace exempting v ſo ſpitefulneſſe men ill towards v without cauſe therefore haue v ſuffer vniuſtly let v paſſe thorough thinke ſtrange thus ye ſee doctrine haue gather vpon texte behoueth v marke although gracious giftes benefites ſhall haue receiued god hande ought comforte v affliction yet notwithſtanding poſsible haue bin eſtimation great greefe dubble hartſore v ſee ſelues ſcorned afterwarde yet behoueth v reſiſte ſuch temptation pacience muſt bee ſenſleſneſſe conſiſteth fele thing declared iob yet neuertheleſſe take courage walke ſtil god pleaſe wee ſhall bee wrongfully ſlaundered wee arme ſelues againſt ſuch battels may bee foyled ſo euer world go thing sathan practizeth ſtirring vp maliciouſe folke inforcing ſlaunder backebite v wee ſhould conclude wee haue loſt oure time dooing good vvhat haue indeuered lyue without blame haue ſtreined ſelfe doe good euerie man man ſay haue eyther done hurt harme yet ſee perſecuted manner vvhat haue gayned walking vprightly thus ye ſee craft pollicie sathan make v beleeue wee loſe oure laboure good therevpon carrie v ſo away ſhould ſticke anoy hinder men otherſide let v marke men vnkindneſſe ought prouoke v ſo much remit ſelues wholly vnto god beeing ſure hee whome muſt yeelde account allowing v ought ſuffiſe v wee ſee men vnthankfull towardes v ſo wee haue indeuered doe good turne ſpit oure face burden v falſe ſlaunders let v aſſure ſelues thereby god calleth v hee ſhould ſay haue walke face therefore ſhall recompenced nowe bylowe contented haue obeyed point vvheras men ſo rayle vpon ende ſhoulde ſtay ſelues nother vpon vpon opinion beeled ſuche fondneſſe ſay haue well deſerued men ſhould praiſe vertues thus yee ſee ſorte wee ought fight againſt temptation ſpoken heere waye let v marke lorde ment giue v ſingular inſtruction theſe chaunges heere meane chaunge happened vntoo iob chaunges ſee holie scripture behold dayly eye reade heathen ſtories firſt declared yeſterday aduaunced honoure dignitie haue bridle reine backe warranting ſelues continue alwayes ſtate make know turning hande god onely ſhake them▪ alſo vtterly ouerthrowe hyghneſſe wherein hath ſet ſtead honour hath gyuen ſhall ſee ſelues aſſaulted ſides wrong ſcornings ſlanders yee ſee ſuche feare god ought brydle ſelues ſuch ſtate dignitie make account earely late maye chaunge god proue meekeneſſe giue menne libertie ſcorne doe many outrage alſo ſee verie paynim knewe haue made many common prouerbes whiche ſerue take away excuſe v true ill put vre bycauſe hard men hold themſelues ſober haue world fortune terme doth ſmile vpon common vice among men beſotte themſelues proſperitie wee well ynough ſay fewe v take heede although thoſe ſayings ordinary euery men confeſſe bee true namely man ought glorie proſperitie ſotte himſelf beleeue ſhall tarrie euer ought thinke vpon change alteration may happen yet notwithſtanding man applyeth indeuer doe ſo therefore ſo muche behoueth v take payne bycauſe wee ſee oure ſelues ſo ſoone ouertaken delightes gloriouſneſſe world end therefore man ſuffer ſelfe caried away inordinate luſtes behoueth v marke doctrine ſo muche better ſet downe heere ſo let menne feare god bethinke ſelues whyle honoure god well able bring downe yea muſte promiſe ſelues eyther monethes dayes diſpoſe themſelues euerie minute haue ſhoulders readie beare burthen reproch ſo euer ſhall pleaſe god put ſhame men marke one point ſurely conſidering frowardneſſe ſee worlde noweadayes ſtandeth v ſo much hande take warning hereof▪ wonder man walketh vprightly honoured day true wicked may bee held ſo ſhort ſpite teeth ſhall fayne leaue vertue yet miſſe afterward fall againe ſuch outrage ſlander good turne light darkneſſe although thē god haue ingraued ſuche inſight deſpiſers maieſtie commend thing know proceede yet neuertheleſſe fal ſuch rage ſhut eye become brutiſhe wilfully intent ſpue blaſphemies raylings againſt god againſt giftes grace holie ſpirite therefore wonder though ſuche feare god walke ſoundneſſe life ſubiect many ſlaunders reuylings ſpecially ſeeing satan thruſteth forwarde wicked ſorte bereauing modeſtie yea inflaming firie rage vve ſee theſe thing commonly therefore behoueth v bee warned paſſe wrong ſlaunders world way ſo euer god liſteth haue v reuyled ſort bee reaſon ſinnes ſayd afore haue ſo much cauſe hold oure tung beare reproche quietly wee haue deſerued iuſt hire fault therevppon behoueth euerie man bethinke ſelfe aduiſedly ſone man ſhall backbite v mocke v make v tale laughingſtocke wee muſt learne acknowledge god putteth v mind make oure owne accuſation euen heathen men could well skil ſay deadly enemy oftentimes profite v freendes freendes beare v cauſeth v feede oure owne vice although intent bee flatter v yet notwithſtanding gentleneſſe vſe bearing v cauſe thinke vpon imperfection amend enemy doe prie vpon v ſeeke meanes lay open faultes v therefore man findeth faulte v ſcoffeth v behoueth v thinke thus gotoo ſee god citeth make mine owne proces accuſe ſelfe ſo may bee mine owne iudge condemne ſelfe ſo ſhame may couered buried lo howe wee ought deale behalfe knowe ſuch ſpeake euill v haue reaſon ſo doe although doe malice yet notwithſtanding let v reply ſay man led deſire reuenge let v looke ſuch thing let v pleade guiltie pray god blot offence end may quit god worlde yea wee know reaſon partie ſhoulde ſpeake euill v behalfe yet let v acknowledge though faultie poynte whereof blamed yet many vice whereof guiltie god ſpareth mee haue come knowledge men pleaſed ſtur abroade filthineſſe ſtinke would bee let v conſider ſay meanes god intendeth ſet ſecretely eye ſinnes whiche wee would haue caſte behinde oure backe make v hate euill v withoute anye flattering oure ſelues marke ſecond point finally conſciences cleere point reſpectes vtterly faultleſſe like angel bycauſe wee ſee men haue cauſe perſecute v wrongfully ourſuffering haue followed god word executing oute office dutie faithfully ſay men blame v indeed ful rancour malice let v aſſure ſelues lordes oure receyuing ſuch rewarde ſhall ende wee ſhould looke better hande ſayd afore ſee cauſe vtterly abaſhed ſelues let v therfore ceaſſe ſay lorde thou art rightuous ſo euer come thus yee ſee poynt behoueth v come heerewithall let v indeuer profite oure ſelues chaſtizementes whiche god ſendeth v day day let v vnderſtand thereby god intendeth faſhion v yeelde prayſe glorifie euen weſee good men reproch like euerie v ought bee pacient pacience prayſe god thing ſuffereth ſo alſo muſte wee blame wee ſee ſuffer good men ſlaundered vvherefore let v muche greeued wee ſee honeſt man ſlaundered reuyled ſo men tung run riot againſt vvee ſee happened vnto iob hee haue ſayde patterne holineſſe yet notwithſtanding wee ſee ſuch reproche ſeemeth bee vtterly paſt recouerie blame god behalfe skorne againſt nay rather wee ſee ſuch affliction happen vnto vertuous man ought humble ſelues although reaſon god doth ſo apparant vnto v yet notwithſtanding let v aſſure ſelues doth without cauſe therefore ought glorifie iudgements although incomprehenſible v marke againe one point let v come thoſe ſo proude diſdaine diſdayne alſo villanouſly reuile thoſe whome god hathe honoured giuing excellent vertues heere wee ſee perſon thoſe whome iob ſpeaketh deteſtable vice man condemneth pryde rather ſhamefull beaſtlineſſe raſcals naughtipackes ſhould ſo lifte vp themſelues againſt man whome ought honoure reuerence vertues behold theſe dogges bark yea barke bite haue ſeene alreadie iob none thoſe credite rich authoritie worldly reſpect vertues bycauſe men ſaw theſe markes god glorie yet yee ſee heere raſcalles ribawdes ſuche haue skill either honoure honeſtie doe ruſhe againſt raile vpon tung see ye intollerable villanie may man compare curre dogges barke gnaſhe teeth although bite vice borne withall bee conuinced verie truth reaſon condemned vvherefore let v learne follow miſlike condemn others ſo god maketh chaunges ſo man falleth downe whereas bene great eſtimation afore let v ſo farre ouerſeene crie againſt let come remembrance making ſuch alteration worlde god intendeth waken euerie v ſhould preſumptuous according owne nature muche inclyned therevnto poore man neuer credite eſtimation world hath heard talke nowe ſee great perſonage caſt downe mountaine fell downe elſe ſhould thinke oure lorde intendeth ſet ſo muche greater brightneſſe vpon iudgementes intente ſhoulde conſider ſelfe heere ſillie woorme doe creepe vpon earth ſuche one ſoare aboue cloudes yet notwithſtanding ſee god hath caſt downe myne eye vvell arte thou ſtarke foole thou prayſe eſteeme thy ſelfe yee ſee howe little one ought take warning walke feare carefulneſſe lord doth ſo caſt downe greate one eye muſt conſider partes hee caſt downe likewiſe ſoeuer go aduaunce ſelues ſtately ſoeuer men god able inough plucke high neſtes ſetled ſuch degree ſhall ſeeme vnto fortune doe thing agaynſte god ſhewe purpoſe men fancie fortune doe god ſtretcheth hande thing nowe prince great men worlde ought bee afrayde ſee god thunder vppon myghtie one ſuch aduaunced th hie degree pray ought meaneſt ſorte doe furthermore let v well aduiſed alſo wee lifte vp ſelues againſt men good ſooth thing agaynſte nature man hathe nothing hym worthie commendation doth ſo vaunt himſelfe againſt others men may alwayes ſay arte thou put cace man deſerue bee ſet light yet thee doe deſpiſe man bycauſe hee rich bycauſe wiſe bycauſe hee hath commendable quality bycauſe gentleman ſhal finde theſe thing v vvhat bee doone lowe degree ſhould behaue themſelues lowely thoughe wee great yet behoueth v ſtoupe according sainte paule admoniſheth v wee god child hie degree muſt ſtoup make ſelfe equall little one yea euen leaſt nowe bee deſtitute vertue knowledge nobilitie worldly goodes ſo haue nothing boaſt yet ruſhe againſt poore man troden vnder foote doe deſerue bee abhorred whole worlde let v take warning text looke well ſelues man bee brought contempte let v conſider much might befall vnto v therefore let v holde oure tung inſtruction whiche wee haue take nowe leſſon well printed mynde wee ſhould ſee ſo manye backbytings raylings ſcoffings worlde euerie v woulde take ſelfe noſe ſaye truely thoughe man haue ſome vertue ryches authoritie yet notwithſtanding man ſhall finde ſelfe ſo perfecte god gyueth many cauſes hang downe heade therefore euerie v examine throughly ſelfe surely wee ſhall bee hilde within boundes modeſtie ſo wee ſhall deſpiſe thoſe vnder foote vaunt ſelues againſt thoſe whome lord putteth reproch thus ye ſee haue beare minde nowe let v come iobs woordes ſayth yong folke mocked yea euen thoſe whoſe father hee woulde haue vouchſafed haue made • g • eepers • ſ • • lde ſeme iob ſpeaketh great ſcornfulneſſe gathereth togither al poſsible diſdain thoſe ſcorned ſaith father beggers helde ſcorne ſeruice raſcalles poore ſteruelings ſcraped vp earth nayles gather rootes eate berry iuniper woodes nowe ſee ſelf ſcorned ſeemeth ſay firſt bluſhe iob inflamed ſome ſcornfulneſſe preſumptiō like haue declared heretofore hee expreſ • ed temptation hee felte yet conſented vnto ſo behoueth v remember text iob loketh vpon thing yet meane ceaſſeth fight againſte gripe gnawed hart maree intent might paciently beare ſuch reproches ſurely ſcorned ſuch haue cōmendable thing thē much hard ſtrange v vve bee deſpized honeſt men handes conſider muſt ſooth ſelues cace make excuſe ſome cauſe ſeing ſuch men find fault v wicked vnruly ful al ſhamefulneſſe mock v ſurely ſuch extremitie maketh reproche ſeeme greater ſo greeued thus ye ſe iob loked ſaying thoſe ſuch abiects lift vp thēſelues againſt let v mark well howe iob hath declared heretofore honored rich high eſtate noble birth thoſe thing wheron grounded ſelf bicauſe walked ſo great vprightneſſe perfectiō ſight vertues god put men conſtreyned yeelde reuerence abuſed thoſe grace thē ye ſee thought hard greuous cace deſpiſed thoſe whome nothing worthie praiſe howbeit foraſmuch ſee iob brought ſo low let v vnderſtand lord ſend like theſe day behoueth v ſtrengthned example therfore although thing heauy hard v beare yet notwithſtanding let v ſo mylde ſtoupe often ſhall pleaſe god afflict v verely ther euen natural reaſon ought teach v vve muſt thinke ſtrange though verlets ſuche haue neither honeſtie good qualitie maners ruſh rayling ſee come paſſe dayly thing cuſtome ordinarie v ought ſeeme noueltie wee ought throughly acquainted beſides naturall reaſon let v alſo cōſider haue touched alredy lord intent trie pacience better caſteth v manner contempt thoſe authoritie eſtimatiō alſo thoſe verieſt ſhakerags ſo would thinke ſelues bee aſſaulted rather brute beaſtes men therefore lord afflicteth v ſuch mean meeken v vve ſee general thing euen vnto mankynd howe hapneth louse flea fly ſuch vermine make warre againſt great ſmall man exempt himſelf although al men bee combred filth ſtinck yet notwithſtanding lord maketh v ſubiect thoſe wormes anoy v euē though king prince ſo euerie one v muſt abyde wherfore ſo humble v let v marke god wil putteth v ſuch extremitie perſons bace ſtate vaūt ſelues againſt v alwayes ende take away vaineglorie preſumption v vvherfore behalfe let v men haue put themſelues hand god ſay lord ſee ſelf vtterly vnderfoote laſt caſt vouchſafe thou ſlake thy hand draw reproch wherevnto thou haſt put butherewithall behoueth v alſo readie behaue ourſelues well thing whiche wee ſee ordinarily whiche thoſe whiche crouch creepe play liamhounds man whē authoritie credit redie leap neck ſoone ſtate chaunged ſee ouerthrowne ſuch exceſſe ſeeme take pleſure hereby ye ſee maliciouſneſſe hid therfore like euerie v ought armed afore leaue ſuch reproches paciently ſo alſo let euerie v trie himſelfe ende may behaue himſelfe wiſely cace ſometimes wee honoure thoſe whome god abhorreth perceiue ſo peece hypocriſie v ſo much god ouerthrowe oftentimes firſt ſhall runne vpon vve ſee ſuch example ſtories souldiours haue riſen againſt owne prince looke vpon great captaines whiche haue borne ſuch ſway made quake yee ſhall ſee great prince hath bin ouerthrowne euen hazarded liues defence ſhall either gratifie ſucceſſour enemie fall practiſing treaſon committing ſuch cruelty enemy would haue done enemie woulde haue ſhewed pitie earſt hazarded liues ſafetie doe paſſe outrage ſo much cruelly furiouſly vvhen wee ſee ſuch example let v call wittes v beware infected ſuch vice moreouer man might ſay iob ſeemeth bee contrarie ſelfe ſayth hee would haue vouchſafed haue ſet father keeper dogges flock laſt chapter ſhewed himſelfe bee ſo great curteſie hee father fatherleſſe defender widowes alſo eye blinde fote lame ſay compaſsion poore folkes vſed kyndneſſe towardes ſuccoring therfore ſay hee vouchſafed match father dogges ſeemeth cleane contrarie let v marke iob ſpeaketh heere owne diſpoſition towards thing ſelf ſhould ſay worlde counted father worthy keepe dogges thus yee ſee effecte iob ment ſignifie yet muſt beare mind although men haue thing woorthy eſtimation muſt therefore diſdeyne know bee god creature ſuche reſemble ſelues therefore let v honour whoſoeuer hieſt degree may perchance alledge ſort himſelfe reſt men yet notwythſtanding though king muſt haue brotherhood pooreſt ſhepeherds neatherds world except hee put owne nature doubt cheefe excellenteſt thing king hathe ſay manhood hath ſhepehearde aſwell hee ſayth king come ſuche princely ſtocke freends men diſcended adam afterward noe surely touching linage world ſeeth go nobleſt moſt renowmed lynages beſt inſomuch oftē time better bee ſhepeherdes ſonne countrey borne honeſt father mother bee ſonne ſome great perſonage eſtimation world ſo may oftentimes ſonne theefe brothell notwithſtanding aduaunced ſo high degree therefore thing wherein ought glory contrariwiſe muſt come backe againe poynt hee ſpake excellenteſt thing king hathe himſelfe man haue neateheards countrie well king therefore lette great honourable perſonages world boaſt thē ſelues much liſt may make great bragges behalfe yet ſhall men ſtill verieſt raſcalles miſerableſt men whome deſpiſe ſo well vvherefore let v conſider god hath made v one ſelfeſame nature ſet vnion among v behalfe end binde v one another thus ye ſee iob ment text therefore let v marke reherſall hee maketh liuely picture wherein god ſheweth v chaunges alteration world ende ſhould wedded paſſe longing heauenly life ſhal haue continual ſtedfaſtneſſe alſo let v learne know preſente life nothing frailtie miſerie ſhall always ſubiect vnto vntill god haue taken v hence make v parttakers euerlaſting reſt hath prepared v heauen nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement oure faultes praying make v feele ſuche wiſe wee maye learne condemne oureſelues according deede wee haue curſedneſſe therewithall afflict v wee may meanes inured ſorie oure offence mourne referring ſelues vnto praying deface fault haue committed wipe remē brance alſo men intent life may ſtumbling blocke edifying vnto men v greate ſmall may learne frame ſelues obedience hauing mutuall felowſhip one may liue toogither good peace brotherly loue beholding chaunges worlde bee led hope heauenly life ende wee may paſſe heere bylowe pilgrimage wherein hee haue v reſt may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo al people nation earth c cix sermon ſecond vpon xxx chapter 11 bicauſe lorde hath broken corde afflicted mee alſo haue broken brydle againſt mee 12 theyong men riſe vp one ſide pinched feete yea beſet pathes ſtumblingblockes 13 marred vvay indeuered hurt man helped 14 came againſt ouerflovving riuer perſecuted vvrongfully reaſon calamitie 15 feare turned vpon purſued mine excellencie vvinde vvelfare paſſed avvay cloude 16 ſoule vvas poured vpon time aduerſitie caught holde 17 bone perced night reſt 18 clothing hath chaunged coloure greatneſſe miſerie hemme garment cleaueth 19 hath caſt ground become duſt aſhes 20 vvhen crie vnto thee thou heareſt although vvaite thou regardeſt 21 thou art become cruell vnto art againſt vvith ſtrength thy hand bycauſe iob heeretofore declared menne value ſtepped vppe ſo malapertly againſte hee addeth ſuche thing coulde haue beene doone vnto god broken ſtrength ſuche wiſe hee weakened yea vtterly made feeble worldward ſo euerie man might deſpiſe thing meeneth ſimilitude god broken ſinew cord meening vphild hand god haue ſtrong rope holde like god breake rope wee ſlide awaye longer abide goeth wrecke v thus yee ſee howe iobs meening raſcalles ſuch beare countenaunce al aſſayled ſo malapertly ne durſte haue ſet themſelues againſte vnleſſe god refte ſtrength lefte nothing mainteyne ſtate true ſome expounde texte iob ſhould ſay men made beaſt ſo one let looce another tied vp againe much ſtreyned vvee ſee naturall ſenſe pointe well worthy bee noted men doe rayle ſorte againſt v behoueth v always come back ſimilitude god hath loozened v ſo knitting cace bodie without ſinewes like fagot ſheaf corne ſome ſuch like thing vnbounde thing holde togither ſelfe neede gathered vp hilde togither otherwiſe nowe ſelues haue thing keepe v togither therefore behoueth lord bind v vp marke one poynte contrarie parte alſo pleaſeth vnbinde v wee fall aſunder nothing mainteine v ſo muche menne ſhall haue full ſcope ouer v meene euen verieſt raſcals vve haue ſeene heretofore howe office god girde king girdle alſo cut girdle aſunder whereby ſignified vnto v king prince authoritie bycauſe god hathe committed ſword vnto holdeth faſt haue ſo reuerenced contrariwiſe god liſteth cut gyrdle aſunder power ſtrength authoritie woman much leſſe heere wee haue generall doctrine euerie man muſt apply ſelfe whiche wee haue apparant vertue ſtrength wee muſt imagin come ſelues bicauſe god ſtrengthneth v therefore let v alwayes ſubmit oure ſelues vntoo ende wee bee touched vaine preſumption god ſeeth men imagine haue thing ſelues hee hath giuen hee bereeueth make better aduiſed knowe grace howe ought haue eſteemed ſuch time hee made feele vvherefore ſayd let v learne ſurmize vertue ſtrength oure ſelues let v acknowledge vphild hand god like ſheafe corne held togither band therwithal let v know alſo lord liſt vnbind v vntie cord immediatly ſhal fall aſunder haue abiding ſtate forth pleaſeth continue grace towards v happen trampled vnder foote bee troubled incombered yet haue helpe meane reuenge oure ſelues let v call rememberaunce men ſhoulde haue ſuch aduauntage v except giuen aboue much lorde maketh v deſpiſed euerie man lift vp himſelfe againſt v behoueth v beare leſſon well mynde humble ſelues withall vntill wee haue skill knowe god putteth v reproch alſo giueth men leaue perſecute v ſhal neuer tamed wee ought bee marke one pointe iob hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth like complaintes ſay yong men couched downe heeretofore roſe vp one ſide tripped vp heeles make fall caſt ſtones way daſh ſtumble heereby hee meeneth mocked ſides reuerence ſpake ſhort meeneth god layde open iniuries afterward addeth ſoule vexed vvherfore hee ſheweth hee wounded throughe might fall man ſhould mocked paſſe greatly iob ſheweth reproches iniuries men vnto touched hearte cauſe hee ſayeth ſoule beene perſecuted welfare plucked hebrue worde vſeth doth properly ſignifie royall princely excellent alſo boū tifull liberall willing freeharted worde soule expreſſed therefore ſeemeth iob ment name ſoule terme royall princely nobleſt freeſt liberalleſt boūtifulleſt part like king prince termed bountifull liberall bicauſe full liberalitie haue wherewith howbeit much manner hebrewe tung diuers time repete one thing twice elſe ſet two wordes neere ſignification one tende one ende verie meening text iob ſayth highneſse ouerthrowne welfare taken quite firſt therefore ſetteth downe worde excellencie highneſſe afterward addeth word welfare hath ſcope naturall meening whereas hee bene great dignitie nowe quite daſhed whereas bin well garded ſo might ſeeme aduerſitie coulde euer haue touched welfare ſo appayred oppreſſed men become almoſt vtterly deſtitute comfort thoſe vſed theretofore hereby alwayes put mynde touched yeſterday fenſe oure ſelues againſt ſuch chaunges ſeeing wee haue example iob excellent among menne time ſtate bin noble man behold god ſetteth horrible gaſingſtocke euerie man bin readie ſerue hin ſeemed whole worlde ſhould haue fauored yet notwithſtanding euen earſt bin freends become wild beaſts raged againſt bereaue welfare much ſee let v prepare ourſelues pleaſe god afflict v ſame ſort let trouble v meaſure ſeeing ſame happened vnto iob although god exerciſed ſeruaunt ſuch wiſe time hee might ſeeme haue vtterly forſaken yet notwithſtanding ſee looked alwayes vpon pitie iſſue ſheweth vaine haue wayghted leyſure whoſe hand receiued ſo many benefites haue called vpon him▪ haue fled refuge therefore let v like let v repoſe ſelues vpon god goodneſſe let v hold v always promiſe make v feele ende ſhall none towards v towardes iob furthermore although ſtand vpon euery word behoueth euerie v mynde thing treated iob ment expreſſe vnto v ſtate ſo miſerable able make hair ſtand vp vpon head firſt formoſt haue ſhewed excuſeth himſelfe impaciencie tormenting himſelf bicauſe affliction greued exceſsiueneſſe cauſed doe ſo meane let v doubt holie ghoſte ſpeaketh mouth intent oure aduerſities ſeeme great vnable bee borne wee may compare thing hapned iob ſeeing ſcourged much muſt ſo nyce childiſhe oure aduerſities pinch v think god afflicteth v ſore let v ſay happen much vnto iob yea miſerie hee indured much exceſsiue outrageous yee ſee muſt learn pacience declared length touching aduerſities iob ſuffered herewithall commeth purpoſe thing whiche haue touched wit miſerie iob indured mocked ſcorned wronged men alſo caſt downe himſelf although man enemy mocke perceiue well backebyte ſides yet reſt himſelfe ſuch man ſhall ſo greatly tormented vtterly diſmayed indure vndoubtedly man ſee ſuche crueltie men ſatiſfyed miſerie hee indureth alſo fall blowing fire greeuing ſee good halfe deade alreadie ſo euerie man ſtriketh murther increaſe torment wherwith alreadie afflicted vttermoſte augmenteth greef anguiſh much thus ye ſee iob ment ſtreine ſayth terrour tooke hold reſt pulſes beat continually releef like man continuall ague ſo tormented hath leyſure take breath iob ſuch complaint ſignifieth hee onely mocked diuers yet forſake meate drinke myrth able defend thēſelues ſo though men practize euil againſt able bring paſſe contrariwiſe ſheweth ſo afflicted ſtoode feare vnder worde feare hee comprehendeth anguiſhes wee feele either lord god men ſet themſelues againſt v yea word importeth much heauineſſe anguiſhe heauineſſe greef aduerſities preſent feare ſawe death threaten v wee beſieged many daungers imagin indeede miſerie alreadie nothing ſuche miſerie may happen moreouer peraduenture alſo ſide yet another therefore foreſee ſuch daungers ſeemeth vnto v bee eſcaped one death commeth ſecond thirde ſhort aſſayled ſides thing ſtryketh hart dead iob meeneth ſaying feare caught holde within text ought bee well marked v chiefe benefit wee haue men alſo naturally deſire ſafetie god alſo hee ſpeaketh bliſsings doeth aboue thing promiſe v reſt cuſtodie ſhall ſleepe eaſe without feare beeing waked ſo ſhall feare ſleepe euen vnder tree highe wayes ſide although wee neither doore barre lock key chamber yet ſhall ſafe vnder protection neuertheleſſe wee ſee iob ſayeth poſſeſſed feare ſeemeth hee truſt god conſequently bereft ſouerain benefit deſire god hath promiſed child verely faythfull ſhal always haue finally ſuch reſt thēſelues may cheerfull aduerſities bycauſe reſt vpon god goodneſſe know well neuer forget thē ye ſee reſt neuer fail al faithful ſo long truſt god iob well feele part herewithall let v mark god caſt ſeruants ſuch trouble meane little ſhall know ioy holy ghoſt ouerwhelmed choked ſo cannot reſort vnto god warrant themſelues watcheth ouer ſure ſay howſoeuer world goeth yet god preſerue indeed perceyue minded ſuccour yet tary leyſure paciently faithfull may time ſcarce fully doubt ſhall toſſed ſo great waues ſtormes ſhall know becom ſhall caried ſuch violence toſſed turmoyled ſuch faſhion reſt ſhall bee turned trouble done behoueth v vnderſtande firſt peaceable yea euen middeſt aduerſities▪ ſtandeth v hande flee god doubt promiſing bee alwayes v vaine therefore let v mind god promiſes may armed ſides ſo may bee quiet middeſt aduerſities none ſafetie v hope ſuccour god hand long haue cannot fal vpon foot prouerbe ſayth aſſone bee turned away god cannot beleue helpe v hath fatherly care welfare wee vtterly diſmayed ſo amazed knowe meanes world quiet ſelues therefore let v learne ſettle ſelues god promiſes wil ouerwhelmed trembling fearefulneſſe middes aduerſityes furthermore ſo fore oppreſſed knowe become yet let v ceaſſe reſort god hoping hee chace away oure darkneſſe ſuffer v continue alwayes ſuche diſtreſſe ſhould remedie aſſwagement ſorrowes ſith wee ſee like happened vnto iob alſo vnto dauid two myriours pacience fayth hope let v bee much diſcomforted ſeemeth infirmitie fleſhe vtterly ouerwhelmed aduerſitie ſeazed ſuch feare vtterly forlorne ſurely god worke continually faythfull one although woorke appeare eye yet ſhall feele truly although faythfull bee ſuch anguiſh feare ſeemeth bee hope goodneſſe god yet ſhal quayle ſuccored notwithſtanding able perceyue ſuccour natural reaſon thus ye ſee wee ought proceede heauineſſe howe wee ought practiſe doctrine profite oure ſelues iob addeth god caſt ground become like duſt aſhes erſt ſayde garment chaunged cleaued skin thereby ſheweth vtterly ouerthrowne one ſparke hope lyfe left inſomuch might haue bin ſayde beholde man vtterly conſumed reigneth nothing death theſe wordes carth dust aſhes onely meeneth ſtrength fayled alſo hee become dead coarſe yea euen good halfe rotten iob ſheweth right wel token life extreeme affliction indured rather hee condemned yea euen men wherein ſhewed v truſt muſte bee tyed thing ſeene wee muſte truſt god yea euen middeſt death wee ſeeme bee paſt recouerie yet notwithſtanding wee muſt take holde life god hathe promiſed v continually imbrace herewithall let v marke alſo god power ſubiect humaine worldely meanes hee worketh ſuch faſhion incomprehenſible ſecrete vntoo v lo two thing wee haue marke text goe ioyntly one another haue wee ſayde fayth muſte bee incloſed thing wee ſee bycauſe grounded vpon power god power infinite may bee compaſſed ruled worldly meanes ought ſeene god able worke ſuch maner vnknowne v seeing ſo behoueth fayth alſo inlarged lykewiſe ſo better vnderſtanding doctrine let v begin ſeconde poynt haue touched god power whereby intendeth work welfare boūded within theſe lower thing therfore wee muſt ſay god thus thus bycauſe order nature ſo bycauſe wee ſee ſome likelihood bycauſe ſuch meane helpe compaſſe doo great wrong inaſmuch thing infinite therfore muſt incloſe god mightie power within imagination vnderſtanding like god goodneſſe endleſſe bottomleſſe pit ſo alſo wiſdome rightuouſneſſe ſame ſaid power would comprehende mightineſſe power pray wee able incloſe brayne impoſsible let v marke well god intendeth ſaue v doeth common faſhion worketh miracle towards v inſomuch rayſe v euen death cauſe chalengeth office ſending men graue talling backe againe alſo ſayd pſalme iſſues outgoings death hand god vvhen ſayde god ende faythfull ſhoulde taſte neereneſſe god hee ſhoulde make feele thing experience conteyned heere namely hath iſſues death hande thoſe iſſues death ſhall haue reigned ouer v ſeeme vtterly ouerwhelmed ſo hope life lord well quicken v yea euen wonderfull faſhion vnknowne vntoo v men cannot perceiue vntill ſhewed effect cauſe alſo ezechiell viſion giuen god vttered worde bone drye wherein ſubſtaunce came togither ſinewes knitte againe breath liuelineſſe came ſo became liuing men thus ye ſee howe ought bee grounded vpon ineſtimable power god wit commeth truſting muſt fall reaſoning▪ hath god meanes thing likely haue wee thing v god knoweth howe deale therefore let v wayte hande ſayde behoueth ſayth bee inlarged vpon mightie power god ſeeing god mightie power meaſured incloſed made ſubiect worldly naturall meanes beleefe alſo muſt ſtretch hie lowe become infinite verely neuer ſo perfect ought ſhal haue ſome little pece yet muſt labor forward although beleefe weake haue receyued meaſure yet muſt alwayes tend marke vvhat marke euen reſt ſelues god wayte helpe hande ſhall wayte muſt reſt vpon theſe earthly thing euery one v muſt ſtirre vp himſelfe conſider well lord thou art almightte therefore thou wilt ſaue v thy mightie power vnknowne v yet lo ſhewed v ſtreyne ſeeing god hath giuen v ſuch proofe mightie power perſon iob let ſame confirme v ſo much ende iob hath ſpoken wrong reproches done vntoo complained feare wherewith ſeazed directeth himſelfe vnto god ſayeth althoughe turned himſelfe vnto god call vpon heard yea •• ld wayted god leyſure god pitied ne made countenance regard worſe turned toward cruell perſon surely greeuouſeſt temptation myghte bee aduerſitie happen vntoo v wee knowe god ſetting v worlde condition wee ſhould tempted diuers wayes martyred many miſeries intent ſhewe v tranſitorie lyfe nothing woorth againe wee haue ſome ſorrowe frayltie beareth wee bee ſtoute ynough comfort ſelues impute ſtill febleneſſe nature flee vnto god yet feele eaſe hand rather diſſembleth ſo tyme ſeemeth bee loſt praying vnto vtter extremitie vvhy ſo ſoueraine remedie whiche god giueth v hee ſayeth come vnto mee afterdeale yea good deade ſhall perceyue haue power quicken recouer thoſe quayled rayſe vp dead fetch graues ſuncken yea euen ſo deepe might ſeeme ſhould neuer come god therfore liberall ynough promiſe v wil neuer refuze prayer come ſeke ſhrinketh away ſeemeth deaf temptation able ouerwhelme v vtterly therfore let v mark well text iob ment declare come euen vnto hel chaſtized common faſhion god outward appearance ſo forſaken might cōclude haue hitherto bin deceyued ſeruing god haue beguiled ſelf hoping would helpe ſauiour deed ſayth ſeruants ſhall afflicted howbeit calleth ſaying cal vpon day thy trouble heare thee thou ſhalt glorifie ſame ought hope life euē death power behold god openeth v gate ſayth nere thoſe call vpon truth ſaith iob ſeeke thee ſ • nd thee not▪ call vpon thee thou anſwereſt knock gate ſtill kept ſhut vvhy ſayth ſo man might firſt demaund whether god hath performed ſayd promiſe wich made al faithfull nere thoſe call vpon although thoſe textes yet written yet god ceaſe haue pitie vpon continually howbeit cauſing written afterward declared one one hath always ſhewed himſelf iob loſt labor praying vnto god theſe promiſes ſhould haue bin falſe god wil nere vnto thoſe call vpon truth heare thoſe cal vpō graunt whatſoeuer asked name lord ieſus chriſt yea readie ſuccor v open mouth let v mark wel although iob thē perceyue god would ſuccor yet notwithſtanding knew end god alſo made feele according ſee euē come paſſe let v marke ſay wee muſt iudge god help according euery moment time great reſtrayning wee muſt tary end though ſee lord openeth eares requeſts yet ſhall end affliction always happy continue calling vpon howſoeuer world go v let v ſurmize wil heare v beſech ſee happened vnto iob ſayth ſhall cry heard threatning light vpon none vnbeleuers crie namely fayth hope certaine promiſe ſpoken ſhal vnfallible foraſmuch cry faythleſſe howling roaring without truſt god although know without forlorne fordone yet ſet mind vpon therfore heard vvherfore ſith ſee temptation cry heard light vpō iob let v cōclude god make coū tenāce heare v reiecteth prayer paſſeth thē holdeth aloof make v cōtinue praier inough haue praied haue ſaid ala lord wilt thou pitie muſt hold delay wee muſt ceaſe paſſe yet ſtil vntil know hath heard v furthermore let v mark wel although god pretend heare prayer yet notwithſtanding ſheweth heareth ſo behold iob cō plaineth hee cried heard bin vtterly ouerwhelmed lord heard requeſt beit perceiued thus ye ſee lord worketh oftentimes v yet imagination cannot diſcern helpeth v ſtād ſcanning maner god helpeth v entreth vnderſtāding vvhy rude groſſe neuertheleſſe lord ſheweth v time ceaſſed neere v euē thought forſaken v although neereneſſe ſecrete yet ceaſſed make power droppe v cōtinually let v inure ourſelues theſe temptation namely pray vnto god trouble feele eaſe rather miſcheef increaſeth god whetteth himſelfe agaynſt v greeue v wee ſeeke vnto wee muſt therefore hope tarie leyſure paciently ſay truth lord battaile right ſore seeing iob weake man wee bee hath paſſed way let v pray god ſtrengthen v holy ſpirit grace hee ſhewed iob time dauid time reſt faythfull theyr tymes abated day ye ſee behoueth v fight till haue fully gotten vpper hand temptation greateſt others call vpon god herd yet iob ſayeth thou hast turned thy ſelfe agaynſt art become though thou wert cruell ſaying hee meeneth onely deliuered miſeries aduerſities eaſed alſo fire ſeemed kindled gulf ſeemed open wider ſhort appayred cace calling vpon god though hee put god mynde puniſhe may ſee great temptation man pray calamitie heard iob hath felt ſo may alſo oftentimes feele farre greater greef looke neere vpon ſay calling vpon god doeth ſo little auayle v ſeemeth rather prouoke ſo dooing maketh feercer agaynſt v ſo thus ye bee importunate vpon mee giue much able beare rod light ticke little finger lay maine ſtrokes drawe ſworde beate downe ground ſeemeth erewhyles gaine nothing praying onely put god mind rough ſharpe v vexe v make affliction greeuouſer exceed ſo farre conſume v vtterly lo ſhall ſeeme vnto faythfull euery one v ſhall find himſelf done herevpon let v marke well declared hereby iob muſt think ſtrange god liſteth trie fayth ſort ſay wee faint miſerie ſhall increaſe although hee heare v firſt pretend bee yet ſtill ſtirred againſt v yet notwithſtanding although ſuch thing come mind let v truſt ſuccour v according trouble increaſe ſo alſo hee ſuccour v ſuch ſort hee ſuffer v quaile ſhall continually vphilde hande howbeeit vnknowne maner ſhall haue throughly exerciſed faith make v feele hee alienated v afflicted v thus ye ſee howe behooueth v practiſe ſentence ende ſeeme heard may faint diſmayed ouercome hold vttermoſt whatſoeuer temptation god ſendeth v yea though ſee death preſent eye inſomuch drowned gulf hell yet let v doubt like good god heard ſeruant iob ſo alſo end giue good happie iſſue aduerſities nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying touche v ſuch wiſe wee may turne true repentance exerciſed manifold want miſeries affliction linger vpon v temporall life may rightly humbled vnder obedience giue ſelues wholy ſeruice put ſelues hande acknowledging hath power authoritie ouer v middeſt diſtreſſes wherewith wee bee combred may pleaſe ſo aſſwage greefes grace holy ſpirit may ſtill reioyce alwayes truſt goodneſſe euen till hee haue deliuered v neceſsities miſeries mortall life called v heauenly reſt may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c cx sermon third vpon xxx chapter 21 thou art become cruell vnto haſt caught vp vvith force thy hand 22 thou haſt lifted mee vp aboue vvynde cauſed mee ryde vpon made vvitte fayle 23 knovv thou vvilt put graue houſe appoynted liue 24 yet ſhall none ſtretch hande thither although many crie affliction 25 haue vvept vvith ſuch hard dayes hath ſoulebin ſorie poore 26 haue looked good euill come vppon mee vvayted light beholde heere darkneſſe 27 bovvels boyle reſt time aduerſitie hathe caught holde mee 28 go mourning crie congregation 29 vvere brother dragon companion eſtriges 30 skinne become blacke vpon bone dryed vp 31 harpe turned vveeping organes voyce lamenting haue declared heretofore great temptation iob indured whē ſeemed praying god good laſt refuge aduerſities ſouerain remedie neuer faile v ſeeme bee diſappointed hope god doo make though deaf ſhort profit prayer ſupplications hell gapeth open vpon v muſt needes fall vtter deſpaire god hold v back ſhew delaying ſuccour v without cauſe god wrought ſingular power behalfe ſurely ſhould vtterly ouerwhelme finde relief miſeries praying vnto ſeing happened vnto iob let euery v diſpoſe himſelfe example god ſuffer v linger pain oftentimes commeth paſſe ſuccored hand would wiſh let v tarrie paciently fight againſt ſuch temptation yea let v indeuour alſo obey ynough v pray vnto god muſt alſo brydle affection aduerſitie preſſe v troubled yet neuertheleſſe muſt abide ſtill ſtedfaftneſſe ſpoken ſo wee haue bin ſubiect good good god time let v continue ſame end ſeemed v ouercharged yea euen mids aduerſities let preſent example come remembrance end ſhew although god hyde himſelfe ſeruaunts make feele working firſt yet neuer forgetteth thē heareth length perceyueth conueniēt time let v remember apoſtles leſſon faith muſt ioined pacience muſt exerciſed many battailes come triumph life ordeyned fight text followeth haue touched alreadie namely god ſhewed himſelfe cruell towardes iob nowe hee ſpeaketh ſo accuſe god vnrightuouſneſſe ſhewe extremitie paine felt tormented exceſsiue rigour wee maye well terme ſame crueltie yet foloweth ſhoulde condemne god ye ſee iobs meening better conceyuing heereof let v beare minde hath bin declared heretofore namely faythful preſſed hand god doo feele ſo terrible anguiſhe poſsible bee expreſſed without cauſe dauid bewayling affliction god layd vpon vſed theſe ſimilitudes namely brought bottome deepes light left bone rotten maree dried vp ſtrength withered tongue cleaued roofe mouth condemned death ſo remedie let v marke ſpeaking ſo expreſſe vehemencie greeſe wherewith poore faithfull one oppreſſed feele wrathe god mindes miſgiue v god agaynſte v paſſeth miſeryes wee feare ſo much doth diſtreſſe torment increaſe vnbeleeuers deſpiſers god heatheniſh folke blockiſh looke vpon man hardned euill hee doth nothing ſcoffe religion vvell god ſcourge doubt ſhall enforced crie ala yet loketh hand ſtriketh feeleth ſtripes hee thinketh god ſtriketh whereas faythfull bycauſe knowe welfare conſiſteth fauor god fatherly goodneſſe cōfort themſelues therewith middes aduerſities god ſeeme become enimie haue ſhaken thē haue withdrawen himſelf frō although otherwiſe eaſe thing ſell would haue yet notwithſtanding conceiue ſuch hartgrief knowe become cauſe king ezechias ſayd god cruel lion againſt cruſhed bond aſunder teeth ment ezechias find fault god ſtand contention againſt vvhy doth thē liken ſo lion wild beaſt commeth ſwallow vp pray craſh breake aſunder ſayde afore expreſſe feare wherwith poore faithful one tormented feele god wrath perceyue owne ſinnes ſee hee ſheweth himſelf iudge muſt needes poſſeſſed ſuch anguiſh ſurmounteth bodily harmes therfore wheras iob cōplayneth god turned againſt crueltie meeneth god paſſeth meaſure vſed tyrannie vnrightuous expreſſeth grief exceſſe miſerie wherin yet notwithſtanding let v marke well iob ſpeaketh ſo doth man incombered wit therfore vtterly excuſed haue declared heretofore truely whenſoeuer affection ouermayſter v vnpoſsible ſhould think god ſpeake ſo reuerently ought vvhy ſo affection blind ſpeake god ſuch reuerēce deſerueth behoueth v gather wit v kepe thē quiet peaſable ſeeing iob ſheweth declareth former temptation dout ſpeaketh vnaduiſedly therefore muſt draw ſaying example though lawfull v follow let v conſider although man indeuer bridle himſelfe yet ſo ouerrule infirmitie alwayes ſomewhat worthie blame condemned ſo much ought heedfull brydle affection conſidering beſt cannot ſo ſubiect vnto god requiſite thus two thing haue note one god ſheweth himſelfe againſt v ſtead receiuing v free goodneſſe loue ſeemeth enimie owne ſinnes reproue v ſee nothing ſignes curſe vpon v cānot muſt need extremely tormented marke one point neceſſarie leſſon ende euery man may prepare himſelf afore hand wee come pinch may bee ſo armed fall vtter deſpaire middeſt gulf may taſt ſome part god comfort wayte paciently good iſſue ſee therfore let v think thing bee deſyred neuer haue anguiſh put feare meeter infidel deſpiſers god become brutiſhe haue declared afore ſwine oxe feele miſerie outward ſenſe leadeth euen ſo fare lewde perſones doted vnderſtanding would faine forget god thruſt remembraunce name vnder foote contrarywiſe let v ſure expedient v bee wakened ſuch drowſineſſe feele god wrath ende may walk greater warineſſe learne therby humble ſelues mē ſhall neuer know acknowledge owne weakeneſſe ſufficiently till haue cyted themſelues god ſayd man happie trieth examineth himſelfe behold retchleſneſſe whē wit dulled high way deſtruction ſeing good expedient welfare bee carefull let v vnderſtand without cauſe lorde maketh v feele wrath intent ſhould bethink v better ſinnes mark one point ſecond let v marke wee neuer bee brought ſo well obedience god ruling affection ouergreat gainſtriuings ſtill according wee ſee although iob mirrour pacience yet notwithſtanding ſo well ſtayed ouermayſter himſelfe hee ſpake god proceeded ſuch reuerence hee ought haue done ranne hedlong temptatiō wherof ouercome reſiſted although much ado seing paſsions v ſo farre ſquare let v learne hold priſon haue well fought tame ſelues let v ſtill conſider much imperfection v god ſhould always find wherfore condemne v bare v infinite goodneſſe lo haue note expreſſe great feare greef miſerie iob touched withall addeth god lifted vp vpon winde made ride aire cauſed ſtrength ſubſtance faile vvhen man ſo caught vp caried away whirle winde dreadfull thing man beaten died woulde ſo terrible god hoyſeth vp aire ſodaine tempeſt vve ſee iobs intent confirme matter hee hath declared wit god exerciſeth tryeth ſeruaunts ſtraunge faſhions therfore let v conceyue god wrath onely according example wee haue ſeene eye felt owne experience let v vnderſtand god try v ſuch meanes vnknowne v yea euē ſuch wiſe ſhall worſe forlorne whē know let v alſo pray god ſtrengthen v need although outwarde apparance wee ſee nothing ſides graue ſeemeth ſhoulde ſwallowed vp bodily death alſo hel yet notwithſtāding let v ceaſe cōtinue feare god reſt always vpon truſt goodneſſe determining fully call vpon flee vnto alone refuge yea though ſenſes withſtood ſeemed v wee barred acceſſe vnto thus ye ſee haue minde theſe verſes ſo let v thinke bee needleſſe tale mention made windes ſtormes god making ride aire ſerueth ſhewe lorde hath ſtraunge wayes chaſtice v pleaſeth wee ought taken vnwares want hauing thought hand furthermore feele ſo great outrageous affliction v let v aſſure oure ſelues bycauſe god beareth v ought ſuffer aduerſitie grieued tormented reaſon ſo may ſeeme vnto v let v take example iob thou art yet come extremitie good ſeruant god cauſe therof thy god hath reſpect thy febleneſſe handle thee ſo roughly though hee could well hath iuſt cauſe ſo thou ſeeſt howe vſeth gentleneſſe ſtill towards thee rigour ſoeuer thou feeleſt thou art yet ſo martyred thou canſt ſay come vpō thee cruel liō hath torne thee peeces thou canſt alledge ſuch thing therefore thou mayſt wel ſeeke thy good god returne vnto ſeeing ſheweth himſelfe ſo kindharted pitiful towards thee wil ſtil thy father preſeruer ye ſee thē compariſon ought ſerue turne behoueth v maſter affection fele much hartburning repining ſelues tempted ſtomaking rebelling againſt god behoueth v ſay thinke vpon thing ſet downe iob alledgeth vnto god poore fraile man neere vnto death therefore maruell god ſhould perſecute ſo roughly know ſayth thou wilt ſende mee graue houſe belongeth vnto liue seeing ſtate men ſuch thou haſt ſet heere make paſſe away moment ſhouldſt thou trie thy ſelf vtter thy force vpon againſt lo iobs meening haue heard like ſentences heretofore without cauſe repeated vndoubtedly god haue v pray vnto ſetteth infirmitie fraile ſtate moue take v mercy eaſe v ſayde pſalme lorde knoweth duſt haue paſſed world muſt faine come rottenneſſe ſeing know god ſpareth v pitieth miſeries ought promiſe moue v pray vnto ſort another text ſaid god forgiueth men ſinnes bycauſe ſeeth ſhadow paſſeth vaniſheth away therefore pray god deliuer v miſeries let v learne ought alledge wee ſelues nothing although haue life yet wee die turning hand inſomuch euen cheef floure floriſhing time likened vnto graſſe greene day cut downe tomorow ſo ereth dryeth without moiſture ſubſtance alledging theſe thing vnto god make pitiful towards v deliuer v miſeries hath need put mind knoweth infirmity better ſelues therfore needeth aduertiſed like praying owne ſelues ſo lykewiſe requeſts reaſons alledge prayer owne vſe profit man alledge vnto god poore fraile creature beholdeth himſelf himſelf teacheth himſelf lowlineſſe think vpon ſtate ſhall alwayes puffed vp pride elſe ſhal diſpoſed ought obteine mercie lord bring v point ouerthrowne ſelues ſhal better diſpoſed ſeke ayde yea greater earneſtneſſe deſire forthermore lord alſo receiueth accepteth ſeruice demaū deth aboue thing wit ſeruice broken lowly hart ſayde pſalme ye ſee thē alledging frailtie vnto god duſt rottenneſſe yea bee nought worſe nought muſt induce take v mercie let v mark alſo muſt repining mingled ſuch complaint wee may haue grudging hartburning ſurely iob ſo good ſtay himſelf ought haue purpoſe ſayth know muſt go graue euen houſe liuing creature doubt ſheweth exceſſe paſsion wherewith hee tempted ouercome yet felt ſuch rebelling himſelfe yelded ſo peaceably god wil ought haue done ſhould ſay thou tryeſt mee thou perſecuteſt muſt thou needes ſhewe thy ſelfe ſo ſharpe rygorous agaynſt poore creature nothing behoueth v beware ſuch impaciencie heerein wee ſee corruption nature euen beſt thing v alwayes mingled ſome faultineſſe except god preſerue v miracle ſayd heretofore good holye thing men whiche ſmitten god hand ſhould obteining mercy alledge owne feebleneſſe ſhewe life nothing haue anye ſtrength death threatneth euery minute houre ſay good holye thing ſerueth humble v ende wee may offer vntoo god ſacrifice pleaſeth ſo well yet notwithſtanding turne thing euill according wee ſee preſent example man ſay vntoo god lorde thou knoweſt ſhadowe paſſeth vaniſheth away ſtrength ſmoke man ſay ſpeake ſo therewithall frette repyne bycauſe hee thinketh ſtraunge god ſhoulde chaſtice doubt ſame wicked curſed paſsing yet haue tolde complaint good profitable ſo deede men withhold themſelues mingling ſome exceſſe alwayes peruerting thing good ſo ſuch vngraciouſneſſe nature wee corrupt good turne euill much behoueth v ſtande alwayes vppon oure garde miſtruſt ſelues ſeeing ſo wauering wee cannot follow right foorth thing god commaundeth v yet notwithſtanding muſt therfore diſcōfort ſelues lord take v good worth ſo cōdemne exceſſe ſelues truly muſt vſe flattery make ſelues beleue vice vice muſt cōdemne whē haue ſo doubt lord receiueth v withall behoueth v returne iobs intēt go graue ſayth know none ſhal ſtretch hand thither god ſhal ſtretch hand thither natural ſenſe neuer ſo many men haue bewayled yet ſhall none ſtretche hande thither ſuccour death hath caught mee remedie man helpe booteth vvee ſee iobs intent ſay ſeeing death taryeth v allotted v bee deade clean diſpatched man ſuccour v leaſtwiſe giue v ſome truce wee bee heere vvhy vttereſt thou ſo great rigour agaynſt v thus ye ſee effect iob ment ſay haue tolde alreadie wiſe may bee lawfull v vſe complaynt witte without murmuring diſputing way let v marke intent wee lift vp ſelues agaynſt god ne ſtryue agaynſt roddes wherewith hee ſcourgeth v extremitie behoueth v come one conſideration although go forwarde vnto death haue alwayes one foote graue yet wee knowe god hath ſtretched hand deliuer v thence ende came ieſus chriſt world yea went downe hell ſay ſuffered hee anguiſhes due wretched ſinners deliuer v men cannot nowe conceyue good hope bee comforted death al one would denie lord ieſus chriſt hath ſuffered perſon whereas sonne god abaced himſelf ſo farre ſubiect curſe feele god hand agaynſt end deliuer v death aſſure v victorie hath purchaſed v seeing hath power ouer death let reſurrection alwayes come eies let v aſſure ſelues god hath ſtretched ſtrong victorious hande deliuer v bondage satan therin let v conſider although wee haue many aduerſities ſuffer mortal life pleaſe god exerciſe v muſt thinke ſtraunge enter intoo waylings complaint made ſay yea haue paſſed worlde muſt go graue man reſcue wee ſhal reſcued well ynough haue ieſus chriſt redemer ordeyned bee pledge warrant hath aboliſhed paynes death broken bandes satan burſt open braſen gate ſet v free seeing know let v pacient middes al aduerſities worlde aſſuring ſelues although haue battayls bylow haue reſt prepared v aboue heauen fight manfully let v aſſure ſelues wee cannot triumph heauen thus ye ſee haue beare minde fencing arming ſelues agaynſt temptation wherwith iob aſſaulted ſo much ado withſtand furthermore let v marke well thing addeth haut wept aduerſitie hard ſharpe dayes tymes ſoule ſorrowfull poore afflicted haue looked good euill happened vntoo mee haue hoped light behold darkeneſſe hereby iob declareth ſeeth reaſon god dealeth ſo roughly foraſmuch proſperitie hee bene cruell pitifull towards poore ſuch heauineſſe hee bene drunken pleaſures alwayes conſidered miſeries man life ſo hee wept weepe kept companie ſuch tormented aduerſitie thus ye ſee iob alledgeth ſhewe reaſon ſhould ſo afflicted ſurely god beateth v roddes commonly bicauſe ſeeth cannot beare owne eaſe fleſh groweth ouerluſtie elſe cruell towards neighbour lo heere two cauſes god doth ordinarily afflict v wee ſee alſo scripture hee threatneth thoſe doo ſo paſſe bound proſperitie wo ſayeth laugh ſhall weepe men cannot forbeare ouerreaching themſelues bee reſt thing fall woulde haue forget themſelues think exempted aduerſities drunken folkes like drunken man hath ſtaye himſelfe ruſheth horne wilde beaſt euen ſo fare moſt part men god handleth gently ſay abuſe goodneſſe fling rouers giue bridle luſts hath man meate drinke euen fill therevpon inſueth whoredome ſhamfull wantonneſſe yea blaſphemies violence moreouer fond ieſts playes ſuch thing ſhort man cannot hold himſelf good modeſtie ſo long eaſe ye ſee cauſe god afflicteth men ſeeth behoofe ſo corrected furthermore yet one inconuenience haue world paſſe poore men aduerſitie deſpiſe ſet feete neck vve ſee reſpect ſayde reproch sodom gomor behold aboundance bread therewithall pleaſure crueltie ſo vouchſafed ſuccor ſuch need forſomuch eaſe wil intermeddle themſelues trouble incumberances neighbor holde themſelues earthly paradyſe exempt themſelues feeling greefs aduerſities god muſt bee faine handle roughly turne commes forſomuch haue pitie compaſsion miſeries haue ſeene brother god muſt bee faine make fele force anon men would diſcharge themſelues worldly miſeries god ſheweth perforce muſt neceſsitie knowe themſelues ſuch ye ſee doctrine wee haue mark god ordinarie afflicting men either bycauſe haue beene cruell time proſperitie bycauſe haue made themſelues drūken lawleſſe pleaſure erewithall let v marke alſo god might iuſtly keepe v occupied aduerſities though foreſayde cauſes hee hath ſecret determination wherof perceyue reaſon like hapned vnto iob cauſe iob complaineth ſeemeth god ought haue afflicted maner ſeing behaued himſelf ſo aduiſedly rather thinketh god ſhuld haue ſpared ſeing bin ſo fellowlike freendly man bin ſad ſorie ſuch aduerſitie hereby ſee wee haue two thing beare away one lord make v proſper ſo haue peace reſt neceſſarie v exempted greef time muſt delicate tender ſhrinking away frō ſhewing pitie compaſsion towards ſuch aduerſitie muſt touched greefes neighbor mourne thē relieue power leaſtwiſe pray vnto god help thē none meanes thus ye ſee firſt doctrine haue marke furthermore let v fall ſlepe pleaſures fo ſhold cōtinually know thing certaine readie ſuffer whenſoeuer ſhal pleaſe god firſt thing ſay haue beare minde muſt forget ſelues whē god ſpareth v cauſe proſperitie cōtinueth ſtil v abuſe haue ſaid alredie ſecondly god ſend v affliction let v bethink ſelues wel examin whither haue bene ſleepie time proſperitie hereby put mind know fault condemne thē god ſaying lord thou haſt good cauſe puniſh v ſince time thou didſt proſper v thy fauor haue forgotten thee layd brydle neckes taken much libertie therefore good reaſon thou ſhouldeſt puniſh v ſhould feele fruite ſinne vnrulyneſſe lo howe wee ought call mynde former faultes god viſiteth v affliction ſpecially howe wee ought conſider well whether wee haue beene vnmercifull towarde ſuch deſerued ſuccour wee haue made account others good reaſon lorde ſhould handle v roughly ſhuld lerne acknowlege fault lord ſharpneſſe rigor towards v mark one point yet although wee haue indeuored help neighbor haue compaſsion miſeries mourned mourne paul exhorteth v yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſe alwayes diſpoſe ourſelues ſuffering correction ſhall pleaſe god ſend v yea euē though know cauſe doth wee haue beene watchfull time proſperitie abuſed oure eaſe yet wil god miſſe handle v roughly aske doth reaſon manifeſt firſt doth humble v ſo let v alwayes acknowledge rightuous cauſe ſayd ought beare mind theſe two reaſons diſtinctly firſt remēber threatnings written holy ſcripture agaynſt ſuch vnmercifull neighbor play beaſts proſperitie ſecondly conſider although men behaue themſelues myldely ſoberly freendly yet notwithſtanding god ceaſſeth afflict extraordinarie maner ſee hath happened vnto iob vvhat done ſtead ſayeth heere haue wayted light beholde heere darkneſſe haue hoped good behold euill let v looke good according god promiſeth paule ſayeth feare god hath promiſes euerlaſting life alſo preſent tranſitorie life let v always loke welfare god hand yet let v looke ſuch wiſe ſhuld readie receyue aduerſitie whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe ſend v wheras god promiſeth v handle v gently vſe fatherly louing kindneſſe towards v condicionally ſo farre forth expedient ſaluatiō temporall benefit ſuch behoueth deale forth diſtribute meaſure reaſon ſame haue alledged alreadie namely impoſsibilitie leaſtwiſe verie hard matter men ſhould either abuſe corrupt god gift beſtow cleane contrarie meening may wel hope god done v good hee continue ſame yea alſo increaſe ſtill wee muſt alſo looke ſhould therewithall diſpoſe ſelues wholy receyue aduerſitie whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe ſend vvhy ſo muſt make reckning wee haue euerlaſting ſtate oure life without chaunge let v conſider life fraile ſo alſo behoueth v bee ſubiect many chaunges haue proſperitie day god may diſappoint v morow although ſee reaſon yet knoweth let v contented ye ſee ſort faithful ought looke temporal benefit world inioy muſt beleue fully god continue dealing towards hath done thitherto howbeit looking proſperitie behooueth prepare themſelues receyue aduerſitie ſuch ſort may bee taken vnwares thinke ſtraunge hee bereeue benefit handled gently may bee time ſay muſt thinke noueltie god turne hande contrarie way ſmite thus ye ſee looking proſperitie muſt continuall diſpoſing ſelues ſuffer aduerſitie yea ſuffer paciently ende wee miſcarie commeth vpon v furthermore let v concluſion marke well ſayd concerning iob complayneth companion dragon brother eſtriges ſay wilde man ſo number companie men god ſo farre forſaken hee become wilde beaſt ſpeaketh man liued ſuch holyneſſe perfection hee might rather haue bene compared angell mortall creature yet ſee hādled hereby warned put ſelues wholy handes god ceaſe truſte though ſcourge v roughly ſeme minded ouerwhelme v vtterly put thing vre haue ſeene namely though ſhoulde kill v yet would hope ſtill mercie fight againſt battails death grounding ſelues vpō promiſes hold owne ſtill continue ſtedfaſt middeſt aduerſities lo wee haue marke furthermore god ſcourge v ſinnes muſt leſſe plunged ſorrow reaſon thoſe affliction take ſo much meekely quiet mind conſidering haue neede handled ſo ſharply reſpect diſeaſes roted v meane foraſmuch wee cannot bee mery offending god wee haue threatning added change harp mourning organ voyce lamenting vvee ſee world abuſeth god benefit theſe dayes euery man looke himſelfe wee ſhall ſee lorde giue v reſt wee ſtart thinges prouerbe ſayth againe come common ſtate ala ſee
