world farre order may ſhort ſeemeth men haue conſpired greue god ſheweth himſelf louing kinde towards v ſeemeth wee become ſo much bolder prouoke sith ſo may well afrayd turne harpes organes weping wayling ſorow well worthie good reaſon ſhould caſt v heauineſſe anguiſh ſeeing wee haue abuſed benefit ſo ſhamefully yet notwithſtanding pleaſe god make v feele hand affliction whether know cauſe let v therfore ceaſe flee vnto hope receiue v mercy yea verely condemne fault cōdemning ſuche wiſe aſſure warrant ourſelues continue goodneſſe towards v make v alwayes feele grace euen till hee haue filled v full nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may bee bring v trewe repentance yet notwithſtanding wee may ceaſſe taſt cōtinually goodneſſe towards v put truſt therin flee thervnto refuge name lorde ieſus chriſte ſo let v ſay almightie c cxj sermon first vpon xxxj chapter haue made couenant vvith mine eye haue 〈…〉 looked vpon mayde 2 vvhat portion god aboue inheritance almightie heauen 3 cutting rightuouſe confuzion ſuche conſpire practize vvickedneſſe 4 doeth beholde vvayes doth count steppe wee haue ſeene already heeretofore howe iob proteſted ſuch man friendes would haue made beleeue opinion hee reprobate afore god therfore declared hee lyued holily vprightly nowe hee returneth agayne ſame matter without cauſe grieuous temptation men ſhould take hypocrite notwithſtanding walked vprightneſſe heart playne meening god furthermore regard owne reputation men thought god knewe true ought haue thought ſtraunge hee ſholde bee afflicted god hande although liued ſee yet good knewe ende cauſe god viſited ſo ſhall ſee fully winding vp chapter let v looke cō tayned iob intendeth declare hath ſerued god faithfully induring ſo grieuous exceſsiue miſeries offence committed ſome ſecrete reaſon knowne vnto god men neyther know diſcerne firſte giueth record ſoundneſſe ſayeth made couenaunt eye caste vnchaste looke vpon mayde liuing ſigne great angelicall perfection man able proteſt hath bin prouoked vnto euill may well man ſhall haue ſome ſodaine fleeting temptation yet notwithſtanding conſent therevnto rather ſhake hate truely great vertue man coulde haue wit ſo ſound vnattainted corruption could neuer inticed iob paſſeth beyonde better vnderſtanding heereof let v marke three degree faultineſſe ere ſinne haue full ſhape meene euen although ſinne come actuall vvhen iames ſpeaketh ſinne vſeth ſimilitude childebearing ſayeth luſte conceyueth afterward bringeth forth ſinne ſinne accompliſhed commeth actuall deede executing thing ſaye three degree faultineſſe ſinne although come outwarde deede firſte fleeting imagination thought man conceyueth beholding thing thervpon ſome one toy come head elſe although ſee nothing yet notwithſtanding minde ſo tickle vnto euill carieth heere maketh many fancy runne heade doubt ſame faultineſſe yet imputed vnto v ſinne ſecond degree vpon conceyuing ſuch fancie ſomwhat tickled feele wil ſwayeth way although bee conſente agreeyng vnto yet notwithſtanding ſome inwarde pricking prouoke v vntoo nowe wicked ſinne already conceyued afterwarde followeth conſente wee ſettle wil vpon ſo let v performance euill want occaſion opportunitie ye ſee thirde degree ſinne fully ſhapen v although bee outwarde deede well woorthy noted althoughe may ſeeme harde matter yet notwithſtanding nother man woman hee findeth thing ſpeake hath experience day day example wee bee afflicted come imagination thinke doth god minde v man holde himſelfe ſuche conceytes oure nature ſo corrupted inclined vnto euill vnpoſsible wee ſhoulde haue ſuch conceytes ſurely already faulte ſuche thing dooth come theyr minde notwithſtanding wee chace away thinke thus oure ſelues nowe like blaſphemie thinke god pitieth ſuch call vpon wil ſuccour ſuch ſeeke one would denie gouerned worlde therfore whenſoeuer ſuche thing come thought ſurely faulte behoueth v conclude ala lord wretched creature wee full vanitie ſith conceyue ſo monſtruous thoughtes ſeconde poynt aduerſitie preſſeth v griefe increaſeth wee fall ſuch murmuring ala ſhoulde linger ſorte god thought vpon mee woulde haue care helpe mee doeth diſſembleth therefore ſeemeth hath quite gyuen mee vp vvhen conceyue ſuch thought debate ourſelues whither god hath care v behoueth v conſider one hath declared himſelfe towards v receyue promiſes ground ourſelues vpon ſay howſoeuer worlde go yet truſte god flee refuge howbeeit although finally atteyne aſſurance vndoubtedneſſe yet notwithſtanding wauer doubte come therevnto greater fault firſt already guiltie miſtruſt vnbeliefe god bicauſe haue receyued ſo wicked temptation laſtely commeth third degree vtterly ouerthrowen know ſay onely ſort see miſerie hath gotten vpper hande god hath forſlowed long reach hand ſee quite paſte hope recouerie vvhē ſo caſt downe call vpon god take taſt promiſes reſt vpon comforte ſelues third degree ſinne like childe full ſhaped mother wombe remaineth ſhoulde bee borne ſo cace wanteth comming outwarde deede let v come iobs woordes haue made league ſayeth hee couenawit myne eye haue tolde token greate perfection man withholde ſight ſo hee conceyue thing might drawe vnto euill looking him▪ ſhewe true chaſtitie honeſtie muſt needes ſayd cleere angel corruption iobs proteſting heereof vayne wherefore let v conſider hee liued worlde angell god true nature hee ſo alſo wheras ſayeth made couenaunt doone hee ſo profited feare god hee thruſte vnruly luſtes vnder foote ſo ouermaſtered affection hee able bridle keepe vnder ſay wil luſt euill couet wiſhe wyll haue vayne mee ſhall tende diſpleaſure god wyll brydle ſelfe myne eye mouth mine eares thus yee ſee wiſe iob made couenaunt hauing ſuche ſoundeneſſe nature man ſubiect affection bee doubte hee many temptation lyfe howbeeit hee walked ſuche wiſe hee ſo inured feare god admit wicked luſtes thē become habite men terme ſay ſo inured vnto wauering ſtarte one ſide pouoke himſelfe ſhort ſee iob mēt declare indeuered ſerue god alſo inforced himſelfe ſuch wiſe tamed ſubdued affection fleſhe inſomuch nomore payne ſerue god bicauſe battails haue v reaſon frayltie yea reaſon corruptiō nature let v marke came owne power neither could himſelf haue purchaced ſuch perfectiō behoued god reforme ſuch wiſe holy ſpirit ſort ſeparated frō cōmon range men without cauſe dauid maketh requeſt vnto god lorde turne away mine eies may ſee vanitie iob himſelf thing proteſteth doubt dauid might haue obteined ſuch ſtedfaſtneſſe well ſo ſhould haue cōceiued vanitie eye miſſeled caried away menes foraſmuch dauid cōfeſſeth neither could obtayne meere grace god followeth therfore iob coulde owne free make ſuch couenant ſay reaſon beareth ſuche ſway could ouermaſter affection meeneth yeeld god prayſe benefit doth vaunte magnifie himſelfe though purchaced ſuch grace owne trauell hee acknowledgeth god ſo gouerned eyeſight prouoke vnto euill furthermore whē iob ſpeaketh ſo let v marke ſide doth v vnderſtand man behold wife mayde thereby tempted vnto euill ſinne already god yea although outwarde acte putting forth man ſelfe deflowre beguyle woman conſent man ſelfe wiſh although man haue intent reſiſt ſayd temptation wherewith prouoked yet notwithſtanding fayleth offend god poynt better worthy bee marked verely wee heare ſentence whiche lorde ieſus chriſt gyueth vpon namely wee muſt thinke ourſelues cleere diſcharged god abſteyning frō whoredome reſpect body man looke vpon woman vnchaſte looke already condemned whoremonger god moreouer haue ſayd alreadie although conſent vnto yet muſte wee confeſſe haue done amiſſe god ſo muſt humble ourſelues papiſts wel ynough ſay man conſent vnto euill ſay luſt ſuch wiſe woulde fayne occaſion ſerued graunt ſuch conſent damnable ſinne man haue euill liking ſo hee conſent thoroughly papiſtes ſay ſinne horrible blaſphemy ſaid thou ſhalt loue lord thy god thy hart thy ſtrength vvhat meant minde ſtrength god hath limited loue owe vnto ſhould onely hart mindes ſayde wit reaſon vnderſtāding ſtrēgth ſay al ability power nature muſte alſo thorowly applied thervnto man cōceyue euil although conſent yeelde affection fully thervnto pray doth loue god al mind man haue neuer ſo litle peece himſelfe inclining corruptiō although reſt indeuour himſelfe accompliſh lawe doth loue god ought doo vndoubtedly ſinne nothing elſe tranſgreſsing god lawe therfore lette v conclude vayne thoughtes prouoke v vnto euill ſinne wee guyltie godward vnleſſe beare v infinite goodneſſe hee forgiueth thoſe neuertheleſſe behoueth acknowledge ſinne whoſoeuer dooth flatter himſelfe doth prouoke god wrath couer miſchiefe owne damnation ende hypocriſie muſt diſcouered layd open puniſhed reſt whiche imagine amiſſe offende god bee tempted euill gayne nothing nother amend market needes muſte hypocriſie grieuouſly puniſhed vvherefore ſayde afore although wee conſent euill tickled haue ſome liking howbeit withſtand already fault ouerſight v wee conceyue ſuch euill liking already bewrayerh corruptneſſe nature ſurely euill dwelled v alredy turned away ſoundneſſe cleereneſſe god put firſt man doubt ſhould haue eyeſight much pure chaſt ſenſes hearing ſpeaking reſt ſhould ſo pure cleane ſhould haue ſtayne proofe hereof let v conſider well moyſes ſayeth satan came beguyle eue conſequently hir husband giuen eare vnto bin corrupted deſirouſneſſe like vnto god looked vpon tree knowledge good euill ſaw liked obteining knowledge howe looked vpon adam eue ſeene already god ſayde vnto eate fruite haue forbidden houre ſoeuer eate thereof tell plainely ſeparated cōdemned death ye ſee adam eue looked vpon tree doth moyſes laye theyr charge ſinne bycauſe beholde lyking ſay vngratious vntowarde luſte thought good eate whereof came euen hearte beeyng corrupted immediatly marre eyeſight lyke man hath eyſighte marred ouermuche drinking ſome inwarde diſeaſe ſome burning ſome vncōme going loſſe eye lyke man becommeth blind went cōmonly ſome rewme ſome like thing proceſſe time taketh away ſight euen ſo wicked lookes whiche bee condemned hearte already infected corrupted ſome lewde liking eye ſayde ſhould pure cleene himſelfe ſo wee might beholde god creature bee tempted wickedneſſe foraſmuche wee cannot nowe open eye wee ſhall conceyue ſome wicked luſte ſay fayre good immediatly wee offende god greate vntowardneſſe let v know cauſe thereof reygning ſinne v doubtleſſe hath hilde ſuche poſſeſsion v euer ſince adam fall oure nature ſo corrupted cannot looke vpon thing termed fayre bewtifull ſteade beeing prouoked loue god prayſe goodneſſe beſtowing ſo many benefites vpon v offende ſo inſteade glorifying god beeing prouoked loue cannot commend thing fayre good therwithall conceyte tickled yea ſtirred vp either couetouſneſſe whoredome voluptuouſneſſe ſhort looke whatſoeuer fayre good vnder heauen ſame turneth v away frō god whereas ought leade v vnto god welſpring bewtie goodneſſe yes ſurely ſayd wicked luſt nother reigneth ought reigne childrē god ſpeake naturally mā vntil ſuch time god haue wrought true faythfull ſhall bee ſo peruerted haue wittes ſo corrupted draw alwaies vnto euill yet ſhall alwaies haue ſome remnant ſayd infection bring mother wōbe ſhall alwayes haue ſome inwarde pricking moue vnto euil notwithſtanding hate beate downe firſt riſing vp good fayth ſayd v cōceyueth fancy god hath care ſo ſoone wee indure aduerſitie beholde blaſphemy yea curſed blaſphemie conſent vnto minde doo reſt neuer ſo little vpon notwithſtanding fully purpoſe nowe ſee man tempted euill although cōſent vnto ſuppreſſe fight agaynſt yet notwithſtanding fayleth offende god tranſgreſſing law haue ſhewed already alſo cānot proceede frō euill fountayne eye ſelfe ſhold corrupted nother doth ſinne begin come firſt frō thence vvhence frō minde ſoule man doubtleſſe euill muſt needes conceyued firſt within eye tende ſo vnto euill bee prouoked therevnto ſo yee ſee cauſe ſayd iob proteſting abſteined euill vnchaſt lookes ſheweth v ſuche infected therwith cannot cleere themſelues god hath bene ſome faultineſſe vvherefore let v learne ſtande vpon garde flatter ſelues haue touched already ſay let v ſtād vpon garde hard matter pray rule eye ſuch wiſe ſhal tempted euill concupiſcence diſordered luſt bee touched couetouſneſſe ſee good world moued long thoſe thing whiche god giueth v whē ſee eaſe delight pleaſures euery ſtayned lecherouſneſſe ambition couetouſneſſe tēptation ſee ſides impoſsible done leaſtwiſe without great difficultie ſurmoūteth power inſomuch maner impoſsible v opē eye without cōceyuing ſome offence agaynſt god seing ſo let v learn kepe good watch cānot rule ourſelues ſuch wiſe vtterly faultles haue neede flee forgiueneſſe ſinnes wherfore let v cōclude behoueth v fight valiantly cōſidering ſo corrupted cānot meanes vſe ſenſes apply thē thing ther ſhalbe ſome rēnāt wicked corruptiō god miſliketh thē thing ought prouoke v vnto hedefulnes ſecōdly let v learn alſo hūble ourſelues ſeing diuel laboreth rocke v aſlepe hypocriſie end ſhold know fault ſo make worſe worſe therefore let v enter ourſelues haue examined imperfectiōs let v crie god ala lord thou haſt giuen thy grace go forward thy ſeruice indeuor inforce ſelfe reſiſt paſsiōs fight agaynſt ſelfe yet rightuous thee much amiſſe ſtill lo faithfull muche paynes taking inforcing theirſelues aboue ſtrength ought alwayes minde condemne themſelues ſhall faultineſſe mingled good god graūteth learne yeeld thēſelues gilty humble themſelues end may obteine grace theſe poyntes haue marke ſtreyne howſoeuer world go although haue many fancy running head night day therby perceyue maruelous corruption oure nature yet muſt harte marche ſtill forward praying god hee hath begonne ſet v forth ſo continue make v forward increaſe v ſtrength holy ſpirit let v beſeeche haue one foote alredy vpon wicked affection may ſet vpon thē may ſo treade downe may neuer ryſe agayne diuell commeth tempt prouoke v vnto euill may bring paſſe wittes may alwayes ouerreach ſhort god ſpirit may ſo reigne heartes although wicked affection yet may ſo brideled fettered may lift vp themſelues toſſe v hither thither may alwayes ſtand ſtay bee fully reſolued ſay meete oure god ſhoulde gouerne v ſhoulde follow holy yee ſee howe middeſt wicked thought behoueth v take courage walke ſtil goodneſſe aſſuring ourſelues good god wyll beare v ſhould confeſſe ſinne hee contented pardon touching preſent matter poynt wherin differ papiſts papiſts ſay wicked luſts ſinnes ſo man reſiſte curſed blaſphemie ſo god ſhoulde bee fayne renounce himſelfe repeale whole law fleeting opinon conceyued onely ſimple ignorant people grounded determinatiō agreed vpon great doctrours ſchooles rather diueliſhe synagoges contrariwiſe wee ſay altogither ſinnes howbeeit imputed vnto v god hand bicauſe owne free goodneſſe mercie wipeth lord ieſus chriſts ſake whome beleeue ſeeing wee haue ſuche comforte wee ought inforce ſelues ſo muche haue ſayde already furthermore iob ſheweth well knew offended bene blame woorthy vnchaſte looke hee addeth portion god aboue heritage • nightie heauen iob ſheweth ſpeaking vaunt himſelfe afore men purchace himſelfe reputation vertue holineſſe ſeeke praiſe world hath eies faſtned vpon god ſpeaketh god preſence deſiring witneſſe iudge point alſo muſt come hath bin declared heretofore ſo long couet haue life allowed men ſhal full leazings ſtartingholes ſuttle ſhifts inſomuch ſhal make v deface white turne black contrariwiſe make vertue vice lo taking indeuer cōmend ſelues afore men therefore whoſoeuer deſireth walke vprightly haue ſoundneſſe whereof iob ſpeaketh doubtleſſe muſte fayne gather himſelfe ledde away ſay hee ſpeake euill mee ſuche geere muſte bee cutte hee muſte ſummon himſelfe god ſay go howe mee god haue deale though contented men worlde neuer better behoueth v haue mouthes ſhet god contented goodly countenaunce fayre diſguyſings outward ſhewes likelyhoodes hee looketh heart ſearcheth thought diſcouereth hidden darkeneſſe seing ſo let v brydle ourſelues walke ſoundly vprightly contrarie parte drawen giuen deuiſing ſhiftes fayre deckings coloure doings withall haue better ſtuffe ynough v couer ſelues leaues oure father adam vvherfore let v marke well leſſon ſhewed faithfull whē intend walke becommeth v muſt behaue ſelues men nother muſte wee reſt eye vpon muſte beholde heauenly iudge vnderſtande whome wee muſte make anſwere yeelde account marke one poynt furthermore haue touched alreadie iob acknowledgeth god ſuffer vnchaſte lookes vnpuniſhed ſinnes afterwarde hee addeth vnrightuous man ſhall cut vvherein hee ſheweth hee whiche hath giuen eye vanitie condemned ſinner wicked man god notwithſtanding hee haue conſented fully vnto let v beare minde hath bene ſayde concerning iobs tyme although know whither liued lawe yet notwithſtanding liued afore prophetes time wee haue declared mention made man auncient tyme ſo ye ſee iob ſuch time god yet giuen large vtteraunce doctrine ſuche lyghte came afterwarde prophet greatly inlighten thing darke law iob liued afore time therfore ſome litle ſparke reſpect doctrine afterward yet neuertheleſſe knewe coulde tempted euill luſte ſhould blameworthy god ſhall wee bee haue ſunne rightuouſneſſe ſhyning vpon v highnoone day beholde ieſus chriſt goſpel bringeth vsſo great light haue excuſe wee ſay vnderſtande high profounde matter haue wee doctrine large ynough ſeeing god ſhewed v full ſhoulde excuſed wee knewe iob knew heerein ſeene howe greate horrible god vengeance popedome ſeeing thoſe beaſts durſt denie man ſinneth hee ſo tempted vnto euil hath ſuch prouocation conceiueth ſo euill thought ſobeeit conſent throughly iob haue declared already doctrine cōpariſon haue neuertheleſſe know well ynough therefore let v looke neerely ourſelues ſeing god hath graunted v ſuch grace priuiledge make truth much knowne vnto v thā time let v watchfull aſſoone opē eye eſpy vanitie euill affection v let v thinke ſelues ô ſome euil hid vnder haue offended god therfore eye attaynted already ſeeing euill ſheweth ſelfe abroade bee ſparkes reaſon fire therfore muſt learn condemne ourſelues vndoubtedly god mercy wee ſhoulde ouerwhelmed portion heritage prepared v aboue true men cannot iuſtifie v muſte fayne appeare god iudge matter farre otherwiſe iob ſayeth expreſly aboue heauen repeating worde ſuperfluous ſpeache hee maketh couert compariſon betweene god iudgement opinion purchace afore men ye ſee men may iuſtifie v poyntes know filthineſſe pouertie reaſon whereof wee ſhall taken little angel thervpon thinke nothing amiſſe v haue gayned nothing behold iob calleth v vp aboue well true ſinners may perchaunce cleere themſelues eaſily allowed among men ſhall bee nothing vertue outwarde appearance muſte come vp aloft god ouerthrow vayne opinion haue reigned time therefore lette v learne like blameworthy wee haue bene tempted wicked luſtes ſo alſo hyre prepared heauen ſay aboue except oure good god ſpare v vſe fatherly goodneſſe towards v thus yee ſee wee haue beare minde ende may magnifie goodneſſe god puniſheth v rigour alſo prouoked aske forgiueneſſe fault day day ſayde immediatly cutting vnrighteous puniſhment ſuch commit crymes • doth god looke vpon wayes doth nūber ſteppes heere iob expreſſeth plainelye portion heritage whereof ſpake ſerueth wounde v quicke feeling ſinnes true ſtandeth vpon thing ſpoken lawe nother vſeth ſo many wordes yet doth holye ghoſte gyue v heere common leſſon mouth talke god iudgement puniſhment ſendeth vpon ſinners ſo ſlow ſame moueth v whit therfore lord fayne waken v make v feele better terrible wrath horrible thing haue ſo againſt v thus ye ſee iob addeth declaratiō cōteined ſaying cutting vnrightuous ſhall wicked man bee puniſhed ment cutting wicked deſerue rooted god ſhould vtterly ouerwhelme deſtroy according woord cutting importeth heyre heritage haue ſayd men beare themſelues hande ſhall ſcape ſome light puniſhment like offender kepte pryſon knoweth hath deſerued hāging beareth himſelfe hand ſhall ſcape whipping hee ſhall baniſhed euen ſo ſay men conceyue god wrath neither knowe puniſhmentes woorthy bycauſe thinke euerlaſting death vve ſee iob ſpoken portion prepared frō aboue wicked doth without cauſe adde cutting cō fuſion deſtroy vtterly heereby wee knowe god ſpirite reproueth v rechleſneſſe attentiue firſt know god iudgemēts leaſtwiſe vnderſtād owne faultes ſhould haue neede doubling woordes ynoughe v haue bene warned one ſingle woorde holie ghoſte ſpoken portion god prepareth deſpiſers lawe nowe addeth cutting bycauſe brutiſhe man telleth v thing ſimply conceyue poſſeſſed ſuche dulneſſe feele ſtrokes god hand though ſtrike v hard ſhall wee bee wounded wee ought bee threatnings giueth v ſurely hee ſpeake wil touched caſt downe ourſelues ſeing cannot bee ſufficiently humbled blowes hande ſo let v marke well careleſneſſe dulneſſe reproued vvherefore let v wake ſeeing god calleth vpon v ſo earneſtly lette v learne thinke better vpon ourſelues haue marke verſe concluſion whereas iob addeth doeth god looke vpon wayes keepe reckening ſteppes let v marke well hee applieth doctrine himſelfe whiche hee ſet downe generall ſayde hyre portion god aboue heritage god heauen iob ſpoken ſo men applyeth ſame doctrine owne vſe declaring purpoſe ſpoken ſo therefore often god iudgements come remembrance whither men •• l v thē ourſelues reade thē let v haue wiſdome enter ourſelues looke euery one vpon owne perſon god iudgemēts muſt lie buryed neuer bee ſpoken euerye man muſte make auaylable himſelfe put owne particular vſe ye ſee haue marke iob ſet downe generall doctrine came beholding owne perſone ſaying god ſercheth knoweth wayes ſay foraſmuche god iudge men cannot eſcape hand doth god ſayeth knowe wayes dooth keepe reckening ſteppes thus much concerning firſt poynt touching ſeconde let v marke alſo ſtile iob vſeth god marketh wayes ſteppes keepeth reckening ſerueth expreſſe▪ god beholdeth aloofe onely looketh vpon thing apparant worlde alſo looketh neerely narrowly woorkes noteth marketh euerychone ſighte dimme vieweth thing randon marketh counteth numbreth thing ſo nothing eſcapeth nother thing forgotten pray haue better cauſe conſider wayes recken owne ſteppes wee ſee preſent god cauſe mē ſcarcely know hundreth parte ſinnes yea ſome man ſhall commit one faulte hundred time day yet ſcarce thinke vpon cauſe hereof wee thinke god watcheth ouer v wee ſo ſight ſo nothing may hidden forget workes thoughtes therefore lette v way well woordes cōteyned namely god knoweth way reckeneth ſteppes ſay number ſet downe euery article thorough laſte muſte come account ye ſee ſhall gayne whiche haue cloked euill lying flattering muſte come light vvhat remayneth looke neerely ſelues haue bene wont watche continually ende wee bee taken vnwares ſtales layde v ſides ſeeing daunger falling ſo many vice wherewith oure nature ſtuffed let v examine well may bee ſorie pleade guiltie god mourning lette v ſtyll confeſſe dauid vnpoſsible v knowe faultes therefore lette v pray good god hath looked vpon faultes ſinnes whiche ourſelues cannot ſee may pleaſe blotte meanes thereof may repoſe truſte welfare ſaluation thing receyuing v mercie lorde ieſus chriſts ſake alſo oure hauing waſhing wherewith hee hathe clenzed v ſay bloud hath ſhedde redemption nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v ſo feele beeing diſpleaſed ourſelues may learne hate abhorre follow commaundeth appoynteth greater earneſtneſſe affection therewithall may pleaſe ſo reforme v holy ſpirit may reigne quietly v ioyned ſuche perfection may ſeeke nothing bee wholly conformable rightuouſneſſe whiche thing ſhall accompliſhed ſhall haue taken v corruptible lyfe may pleaſe graunt grace c cij sermon ſecond vpon xxxj chapter 5 haue vvalked leazing foote haue bene haſty deceyte 6 let god vvey vvorkes ballaunce iuſtice let trie mine vprightneſſe 7 ſteppes haue turned vvay hart haue vvalked mine eye ſpotte haue cleaued handes 8 let ſovve let man eate frute let plantes rooted vp iob hath proteſted liued chaſtly ſuche ſorte eye defiled one euill looke nowe hee addeth hee liued ſo vprightly among neyghbours foote ſtepped aſide deceyte malice vve ſee toucheth another kinde ſoundneſſe beſides made mention yeſterday hee alſo lay foorth principall poyntes man lyfe particular withoute cauſe ynough man haue abſteyned whoredome except hee bee alſo cleere thefte guyle extortion god haue thing ſundred hath ſet togither hath giuen whole law rule life hath forbidden whordome ſo hath alſo condemned ſtealing lying extortion ſuch thing therfore man intend ſerue god ynough bee cleere one ſinne muſt frame whole life law ſayde afore otherwiſe ſeparating thing whiche cānot meanes put aſunder without apeachemēt god rightuouſneſſe thus ye ſee iob made proteſtation chaſte cleane lyfe addeth hee beguyled man foote ſtepped aſide tyme vntoo leaſing malice well woorthy noted one principall part god requireth lawe ſhoulde haue ſayd vprightneſſe walke bywayes ſuttleties drawe neighboures good vnto v ſurely difficulte vertue ſo howbeeit euery man deſirous counted vpright nature mā alwayes ſo giuen vnto hypocriſie ſo much one worde hearde wherein ſomewhat amiſſe inſomuch buy ſell neyghboures wee alwayes diſguyſing thing drawe owne profite seeing perceyue ſuch roote deceitfulneſſe v haue ſo muche neede giue mindes vprightneſſe ſoūdneſſe ſo may proteſt god lyfe hath ſwarued aſide vntoo leazing alſo another reaſon witte deceytes worſe open violence like killeth man poyſoning faultie ſlaieth man ſworde trayterouſneſſe killing man vnder coloure making friendſhip making good cheere verye deteſtable thing cryme vtterly vnpardonable euen ſo man beguileth neyghbour craftineſſe creepeth boſome ſuttletie ſo man cannot beware ſigne treacherous nature theſe two reaſons therefore ought teach v ſo follow vprightneſſe ſoundneſſe▪ neyghbours may meanes beguiled v firſte thing haue marke heere furthermore let v vnderſtād truth precious thing god ſo much taketh name vpon intendeth expreſſe one needes muſt vntruth guilefulneſſe ſo much deteſtable bycauſe full contrarie nature alſo ſayde muſte faſhioned like vnto image god paule ſetteth downe true holineſſe ſhould ſay whereas men giuen hypocriſie nothing counterfetting intent ſhould come neerer vnto god brought obedience hee printeth marke vpon may know child doth true holineſſe reygne men gouerned god ſpirite reigneth nothing faynedneſſe ſlineſſe fleſh ſay corrupt nature ſhort let v learne man walke ſoundly go ſtreight buſineſſe dealeth neighbour although vertues coulde bee named nothing hee wanted pureneſſe god would haue life well liked let v gyue mindes wholly vprightneſſe ſoundneſſe walke guylefulneſſe vntruth furthermore let v marke alſo iob ſayeth let god wey ballaunce iustice let trye mine vprightneſſe ſimilitude ballaunce notable ſheweth v maner iuſtice wee ſhall haue account haue yeelde may liked allowed wit god weying v ballaunce iuſtice law hee hath declared vnto v ballaunce wherby know whither woorkes good receyuable like ware weyed men ſel pounde euen ſo alſo muſt workes iudged howe god ballaunce haue tolde doctrine profitable v bicauſe men chalēge thēſelues meete beare themſelues hand work ſhall go good euē gouerne thēſelues owne luſt reaſon wherof would god ſhoulde gayneſtande thing haue imagined vtterly diſanull authoritie woonder man ſhoulde deſire maſter owne life▪ owne guide ſhould ſay god might cōmaunde nothing true men woulde aſhamed ſpeake ſo ſay gouerne ſelfe wil follow mine owne brayne god ſhall meddle commaunding thing ye ſee horrible blaſphemie mē vtter mouth folow owne opinion haue cōceyued pray auaunce themſelues aboue god labour thruſt downe bereuing ſoueraintie ſo might commaunde man doo whatſoeuer commeth owne head whatſoeuer himſelfe deemeth good ſo would god ſhould allow bring obedience ſay vnto euill bycauſe god hath forbidden good bycauſe god hath commaunded followeth owne liking imagination doth ſuch man go ſet himſelfe god roume therfore diueliſh preſumption yet notwithſtanding common thing vvherfore let v marke well ſayd ſtreyne behoueth v come ballaunce receyue iudgement either v againſt v according god ſhall haue tried workes▪ namely rule law owne luſtes men imagine another ballaunce fooliſh groſſe wit recompence faultes haue cō mitted god meane wherby ſatisfactions brought papacie ballaunce haue allotted saint michaell put men good workes one ballaunce theyr euill work man haue done good euill papiſts opinion quit god see ape toy ouer groſſe written doth theſe thing ſhall liue god promiſeth life ſaluation accōpliſhing ſome one peece lawe performing whole reſpects contrariwiſe ſayde curſed performe thing conteyned heere therefore breake one article lawe guiltie whole ſayeth iames thus haue touched ouer doltiſhe beaſtlye imagination matche good euill ſort one agaynſt another thinking may exchaunge recompence made god haue ſaid alredy ballance god law thither ſhal work come weyed looke founde conformable god lawe ſhall bee taken allowed good lyke marchandize lawfull put ballance men pay according theyr weyght euen ſo alſo behoueth v come lawe god purpoſe haue ſayde alreadie men bring owne weightes meaſures deſire haue credited city common beame ballaunce euerye man ſhall haue owne weyghtes meaſures nother reaſonable lawfull ſo haue would go hauocke preſeruation good pollycie order equitie neede bee one certayne euen ballaunce ruled therefore men go aboute make theyr woorkes good owne iudgemente opinion woulde forge newe ballaunce wee knowe falſehoode hee ſhall haue falſified common weightes ſhall condemned iuſtly man falſifie rule good lyfe precious god weyghtes world hath committed greater cryme hee forged ſome ware seeing cace ſtandeth ſo lette v learne rule ourſelues scripture ſheweth witte let v workes conſider well god hath appoynted let v without replying take good whiche alloweth lawe reiecte euill whiche hee forbiddeth wee deale ſorte none theſe fooliſhe deuotions among v reygned papacie whereof commeth menne doo ſo lifte vp themſelues euery one deuiſe ſome meenes ſeruing god ſay good ſuche thing bycauſe bring falſe weyghts falſe balaunces euery mā wold preferre owne deuice god reiecteth condemneth euery whit therefore lette v haue meekeneſſe rule gouerne life commaundements god deſire hauing ſundry meanes ſerue god withall ſhall layde away wee ſhall haue one common certayne infallible rule onelye one ballaunce iuſtice one onely lawe god gouerne v although bee difference eſtates yet called backe one generall way vvhen hee ſayeth thou ſhalt committe adulterie thou ſhalte ſteale thou ſhalt lye beare falſe witneſſe ſayeth well greate ſmall ſeeing lorde ſendeth aſwell king handycraftes men generall rule lyfe ſhewing v broade way ende wee ſhould go amiſſe ſo muche leſſe excuſed wee couet holde v alſo laboure giue good example neyghboures ayde one another frame ourſelues ſuch ſorte vnto godwarde wee may v obey bee fully ſubiect becommeth v nowe men ſhunne ballaunce meaſure yet ſhall gayne ſayde immediatly lette god trie myne vprightneſſe vvherein iob ſheweth belongeth onely vnto god iudge whether wee bee good euill true hee ſignifieth twoo thing firſte god iudge mennes liues auenture onely lawe ſecond competent iudge alone although men vſurpe prerogatiue yet notwithſtanding opinion ſhall bee ouerthrowne bycauſe ouerweening vvherefore ought marke well poynt god iudge workes triall lawe ſerueth firſt beate downe vayne truſte hypocrite whiche bring pelting traſhe god haue content himſelfe haue done haue done ſay according ſee papiſtes haue taken much payne deuotions thinke god debte elſe hee woulde neuer quite vnleſſe broughte ſuche thing lette go aske theyr wage ſette woorke god diſalloweth euery whit hee affirmeth hee iudge men workes putting ballaunce ſay examining law deuiſe newe iudgement hee hath giuen v lawe god bothe lawegiuer alſo iudge thing go ioyntly togither howe thinke god ought iudge according whereby men haue bene taught aforehande wit lawe agreableneſſe betweene lawe hath giuen v keepe iudgement muſt execute thus thē cōcerning firſt poynt ye ſee hypocrite ſhall bee confounded vayne preſumption thinke woorkes ſhall bee allowed yet yeeld reuerence god law beare themſelues hande god ſhall owe ouerplus doings compared togither laide ballaunce wee warned haue indeuered followe god ſubmitte ourſelues therevnto workes acceptable vnto god world wil perchance condemne v according wee ſee howe papiſts haue liking thing bycauſe ſo many gay pompes goodlye deckings among v synagoges man come church papiſtes hee ſhall finde full gewgawes ſtuffed yet meane ape make reckening doings ſeeming ſmall matter come thither pray vnto god without gay ceremony gliſter amōg ynough v god alloweth v howe let v looke vpon law vpon thing hee requireth v scripture thing muſt ſtirre vp faithfull giue courage ſerue god according knowe howe muſte follow thing whiche agreeable reſpectes doctrine whiche wee haue receyued goſpell woorde haue ſpoken ſayeth iewes ſhall iudge furthermore lette v alwayes conſider behooueth v come account greate iudge boote v haue bene flattered prayſed men ſayde god trie theſe wordes ſignifieth tryalles made nowe haue certayntie ſtay reſte god ouerthrowe vvherefore lette v learne walke ſuche wiſe wee may proteſt god labouring traueling hath bene towardes deſire hath bene ſubiect vnto wee haue euer honored guyde gouernor lo wee haue marke ſtreyne iob addeth conſequently foote pace ſtepped way heart haue walked myne eye ſpot haue cleaned handes according talke whiche hee concerning vprightneſſe ſoundeneſſe howbeeit expreſſeth thing yet hee ſayde afore firſte hee proteſteth foote ſtepped way verely wee cannot lyue ſo perfectly muſte make many falſe ſteppes oftentimes ſwarue fro though ouerſight frayltie heere iob declareth hee ſteppeth way hee vſeth ſimilitude way scripture woont ſerueth draw v better obeying god vvhen god lawe called way pray ought bee ſpurre pricke v forwarde walke god hathe ordeyned ought alſo bee bridle holde v ſubiection wee haue occaſion go place deſire keepe beſt way yea ſhorteſt eaſieſt certayneſt man beguyle v angry wee ſtray doth grieue v ſomuch euery ſtep werieth v thinke haue clogge lead heeles wee knowe whither wee bee right whether go way seing men ſo careful knowe right way trauayling may come wel iourneyes end great pitie way lyfe wee willing go aſtray ſeeme deſirous negligent inquiring intente wee might ſtarte aſide ſtep way alſo way eye ſo god pointeth finger calleth v thither incoraging v follow warning v turne nother righthand left keepe hie way ſheweth v willing take heede cauſe scripture vſeth ſimilitude way ſhew v miſſe way ignorance excuſe v god hath ſhewed v wil obey good infallible way ſteppe aſide run aſtray like wandering vacabounds contrariwiſe conforme themſelues god lawe word may well run gad trudge vp prophet eſay ſaith ſhall bee trie leg yet way whit like worde ballance iob hath vſed ought holde v awe ſo preſume thing head indeuor frame life god ſo alſo worde way ought teach v walke wee thinke good hold v wholy god ordeineth thus ye ſee effect haue remember iobs proteſtation wit neuer amiſſe impoſsible man though reſpect frailtie ignorance ſaid turning way doth v wit ran aſtray according addeth ſaying hart hath folowed mine tie hereby meneth notſo euil minded conſent vanity men conceiue beholding thing like ſayde yeſterday al lokes many ſparkles kindle fire luſts within v nature ſo froward wee ſee thing faire good wee drawe occaſion offending god thing faire ſtraightwayes loue howe wicked luſt good deſire kindled wiſe vnto euill much mē ſo lightminded conſenting wicked luſtes iob ſaith hart folowed eye howbeit might ſeeme ſome contrarietie betwene maner ſpeach talke yeſterday vvhy ſo told vnchaſt lokes attainted vice proceed hart token hart corrupted thervpon alledged ſpokē moyſes adam eue namely loked vpō tree knowledge good euill ſa •• liked therefore could ther alreadie ſome leude luſt within perſwaded vnto euill eye itſelfe woulde ſinne vnleſſe prouoked euil mind doth iob ſay hart folowed eies ſayd therewithal yeſterday open eye come many leude thought mind beit ofttetimes tickled thē god holdeth v awe holie ſpirit otherwiſe certaine ſhould onely tempted prouoked euill wee ſhould alſo fall bee ouercome hand may perchāce conceiue ſome euil thought firſt ſight yet bee led awaye meanes one poynt therevpon alſo ſet downe three degree faultineſſe firſt haue onely conceyte ſecond heart ſomewhat moued third fully reſolued determined vpō haue note aſmuch men conceiued borne ſinne wholly giuen corruption welſpring whence haue wicked thought ſoone open eye ſome temptation ſtep v yea though ſticke vtterly ſhake ſo whit moued though ſuch thing waue mine eye yet notwithſtāding part hart inclineth therevnto vtterly abhor whence commeth conceit euen ſinne dwelleth v wherin good buried god image ſame v oure father adam beginning vndoubtedly al ourſenſes declared yeſterday ſhuld pure clean infection lokes ſhould tend god ſone ſhould looke vpon creature glorie god would vtter ſelf ſhould led honor bee wholly inflamed loue would vanitie diſorder much leſſe would bee wicked rebelliouſneſſe ſo muche ſhould ſee thing would v goodneſſe let v marke vnchaſt lookes temptation conceiue mean eye ſpring ſayd fountayne originall ſinne ſay ſaide corruption wee drawe father adam frowardneſſe nature much wee bee alienated god ſee theſe two thing may wel ſtand togither namely man ſhould tempted euill wickedneſſe hart yet notwithſtanding conceit commeth eyeſight ſhould affection hearte howe haue told alreadie eyeſight tempting v followe wicked luſtes hart euill alreadie conceiued within ye ſee ſinne goeth formoſt ſo muſt needes concluded hart infected corruption eye ſhoulde bee cleane true yet true alſo ſometimes tempted without inward affectiō like ieſus chriſt ſelfe often tempted yet notwithſtanding anye vncleanneſſe tempted ſuch manner ſound nature might bee outward ſightes continued ſtedfaſt goodneſſe corruptneſſe ſenſes otherwiſe v oure ſenſes corrupted reaſon ſinne neuertheleſſe may ſome corruption ſenſes yet ſhal abide ſound ſtill according declared yeſterday diſtinction ſet downe repeated euen darke treate yet againe little plainelier tempted hautineſſe wee lift eye heauen tempted coue touſneſſe loke vpon good world ſo deſire haue ſaying would ſuche houſe mine would owner ſomuch medowe ſo many vineyardes wee ſee thing bee ſtricken couetouſneſſe oure hart imcline way ſo haue inward deſire feele burning within v long v wee haue thing liking luſteth doth hart walke eye ſay heart hauing conceiued amiſſe thought reaſon eyeſight thorough corruption originall ſinne hath followed ſay hath yelded motion contrarie god law haue bridled affection ſuch wiſe ſomewhat hath ſtirred v vp vnto euill wee haue conceyte ſay fayre yet notwithſtanding ſtoppe elſe ſay thing liked yet therewithall haue ſuche ſtay ourſelues ſay alſo meete mee contented god hath giuen mee ſay heart abyde fettled ſhaken toſſed pricked prouoked ſtand ſtedfaſt contentation pouertie doe oure bodily ſenſes make v conceiue ſome euil thought yet notwithſtanding heart ſettled without mouing ſhort eye may pechance wander bee exceſsiue gaſing condemned bycauſe proceede originall ſinne god imputeth vnto v haue ſayde furthermore whereas iob ſayth heere heart walked eye haue mark thervpon eye created loke vpon god workes ende wee might taught loue reuerence feare become bandes satan inticers come beguile v worke deſtruction god ſay hath created eye ende ende while worlde wee ſhould haue abilitie diſcerne betweene thing ſame might lead v vnto vvhither looke vpward downward ſee lord calleth v himſelfe creature heauen earth meanes allure v come vnto god doth onely ſay come vnto alſo hee draweth v thither goodneſſe according wee ſee howe hee ſheweth ſelfe liberall towardes v therein alſo miniſtreth occaſion v walke feare thus ye ſee ende eye made eye ſhuld haue ſuch meanes behold god glorie poyntes haue ſo froward vſe eye cleane contrarie god haue ſaid eies dazel v deceiue v oft open hale v away make v run aſtray end ſhould become like brute beaſts full wilde vnruly luſts beſides two firebrondes ſet v fire vvheras ought receiue god glory tranſform v therevnto receiue satan firebronds kindle affection intent whole deſire might offend god aduaunce ſelues againſt thus ye ſee poynt ought marke wel end euery one v might beware furthermore much wee vtterly bee diſcharged frailtie corruption eye wil wandring drawe v away euer bee ſome ſodaine conceyts allure v vnto euill let v leaſtwiſe bridle heartes let affection bee gadding wyth eye make v ſtraye way aforeſayde let v learne holde ſelues vnder obedience god ſubiection feare ende hee addeth ſpot cleaning bandes yet one ſimilitude whereby meeneth declare yet better vprightneſſe life like hādle thing oure handes ſo alſo wee haue deale men thing wee deale doe paſſe hāds handled v iob meneth affayres dealing men hee neuer ſtayned craftineſſe violence corruption ſuch thing ſurely greate vprightneſſe neuertheleſſe wee muſt alwayes marke iob ſpeaketh ſelfe waye boaſting rather holie ghoſt intendeth heere giue v myrrour perfection ende wee knowe ſpot v ſhould aſſure ourſelues god calleth ſummoneth v accoūt eſcape vnpuniſhed curſe added let mee ſowe ſaith iob let man eate let plantes plucked vp ſhuld ſay haue labored inrich myſelf vnlawfull gaine let god plucke away al ſubſtance let periſhe goe hauocke yee ſee effecte ſhewed v therefore let v take heed • walke carefully haue done men diſpatche ſelues thereof lightly haue meane trade lyuing contente ſelues howe ſo euer fare strayght wayes rightuous ſo thinke ſelues nothing amiſſe yet wee muſte bee fayne come ballance haue touched bycauſe lawe god moueth v holie ghoſt addeth one helpe example iob hee ſheweth v howe oure lyfe ought bee ruled thus yee ſee howe way wee haue marke iob mente magnifie ſelfe ſhewe owne example howe ought liue beſides alſo although wee haue indeuered walke ſuche perfection wee haue brydeled affection wandring luſts haue haried v away haue alwayes preſerued euerie man right wee haue vſed anye crafte malice againſt man yet muſte wee alwayes hang downe oure heades god wee haue ſeene heeretofore god ſcourge v although oure ſinnes ſome purpoſe namely humble v trie pacience yet muſt caſt heades ſtill furthermore acknowledge wee alwayes guiltie howſoeuer world go god ſhall alwayes finde ſome faulte v ſo might iuſtly reiect whole life thus ye ſee ought practiſe ſentence neuertheleſſe ſhort behoueth v haue eye alwayes faſtned oure handes ſay deale ſo purely thing wee take hande doings may wiſe ſtayned hard v haue ſuch pureneſſe looke howe many dealing wee haue doe ſo many peeces pitch paſſe handes howe poſſible ſhould ſcape without catching ſome ſpotte god therefore muſt bee faine worke cace preſerue v euen woonderfull faſhion ought prouoke v greately prayer wee ſee ſuche vncorruptneſſe required oure handes wee drawe cleane backwardes ſo muche wee ſo farre beeing cleane wee perceyue ſpottes blottes v remayneth none ſhiftes flie god refuge craue forgiueneſſe faultes paſt alſo deſire guide v holie ſpirite keepe hand cleane ſo may reſtrained craftineſſe malicious dealing thing haue men ſo euer ouer let v marke well curſe iob ſetteth downe although hee applie owne perſon yet notwithſtanding pronounceth generally payment prepared thoſe defile handes ſort wickedneſſe haue deuiſed againſt neighbor couetous men indeuer inriche themſelues men coſts man ſo giuen ſelfe paſſeth nothing worlde grow riche let v thinke ſame ſhall indure long length god execute thing hee pronounceth heere wit ſuch haue planted ſhall eate fruite verie deede wee ſee ſuche haue heaped moſte goodes togither inioy god bereeueth oftentymes man needes forbid eating drinking thing haue gotten themſelues ſo niggardly dare cheriſhe themſelues pine awaye become owne tormentours afterward looke gathered togither long time great labour doth god plucke ſweepe away child make fayre diſpatch goodes reſerued ſtill bee laſt ſhall oftentimes make rope child drawe gallowes vvee ſee theſe iudgements god eies therfore let v learne walk vprightly think thoſe haue gathered moſt worlde happieſt god curſe alwayes taile miſſe thoſe haue pilled polled men goodes vvherefore let v bethinke v contented litle god ſhall giue v aſſuring oure ſelues wee walke continually feare hee bee good foſterfather v neuer faile v deale like child towards vſe true loue brotherly vprightneſſe towards neyghbours let v fal face good god acknowledgement oure ſinnes praying ſo open eye may walk preſence ſeeing hath ſhewed himſelf ſo familiarly vnto v worde alſo may behold hath declared himſelfe wee may make ſuch triall whole life wee may peceyue wretchedneſſe v miſeries wherevnto ſubiect flie vnto remedie hee hath ſet forth vnto v goodneſſe whiche haue recourſe vnto mercie praye guide v ſuch wiſe holie ſpirite renouncing oure wicked affection maye ſeeke frame oure ſelues wholy holy walke vnder obeiſance vntill come full perfection wherevnto behoueth v tende life long appeereth alreadie angel may pleaſe graunt grace c cxiij sermon third vpon xxxj chapter 9 heart haue beene deceyued vvoman haue laide vvaight doore neighbour 10 let vvife grinde vnto another man let ſtranngers bovv dovvne vpon hir 11 looceneſſe iniquitie condemned 12 fyre deuoureth deſtruction yea vvhich ſhould plucke vp roote reuenue 13 haue refuſed iudgement ſeruant maid vvhen ſtriued againſt 14 vvhat ſhall vvhen god ſtandeth vp vvhat ſhall anſvvere vvhen doth viſit 15 hath hath made made alſo vvombe hath faſhioned v vvombe haue heere twoo proteſtations iobs making worthie bee marked one hee liued ſo chaſtly hee cleere god ſeeking abuſe man wife hee bin proud cruell towards ſuch vnderlings therwithal bin ſo far frō vaūting himſelf againſt equal toke moſt power ſhewed ſelf moſt gentle mylde behoueth v beare mynde hath bin ſaid heretofore wit iobs proteſting haue walked rightly god mē without mā wrong one kind alone whole law god according laieth forth thing conteyned therein ought alſo ſpeciall warning vnto v haue ſhewed inoughe v indeuer diſcharge duty ſome one point leaue reſt vndone god haue thing ſeparated diſmembred hee hath ioyned togither lawe vvherefore let v beare mynd hath bin ſet heretofore let v follow order iob kepeth mark reſidue added touching ſpeaketh aduoutrie mening offreth himſelf ſuffer ſhame hauing wife abandoned whoredome ſought abuſe man wife let men ſaith bow vpon wife let hir ſuffer reproch yea let indure well ſhee haue beene led away haue layde wayte neighbor doore ſay haue watched harme afterward declareth hee abhorred whordom ſo much ſaith wickedneſſe yea iniquitie belongeth vnto iudges▪ ſay worthy condemned deuouring fire thing would plucke vp welth roote thus yee ſee howe iob continued chaſtitie gaue ſelf filthineſſe whordom bicauſe knew curſed thing ſuch offence god could beare touching puniſhmēt ſetteth iuſt reward whoremaſters aduouterers wit like ſhuld done vnto haue done vnto others onely text mention made haue notable example aboue others perſon dauid although holie prophet king choſen among mankind hauing recorde god hath found according owne hart yet notwithſtanding ſee puniſhment fel vpō ſtepping aſide rauiſhing another man wife prophete nathan declared god curſe vnto ſaying thou haſt done ſecrete ſhal payd thee openly ſunne ſhall beare witneſſe dauid wrought ſo wilily thought ſinne ſhould neuer haue bene known world ſhould haue gone clere away much man reproch mutter god reuenged hypocriſie told although done wickedneſſe ſecret yet ſhould come open light ſhuld aſhamed ſinnes known men hideous thing owne ſonne ſhoulde cauſe trumpet blowne aſſemble people opē ſight world put king concubine al villanie behold inceſt againſt nature yet god declareth hapned caſualtie ſaith haue done ſhould ſay let men loke onely perſon abſolon without going true mē ought abhor breaking order nature wiſe ouerthrowing honeſtie working ſuche villanie towards father neuertheleſſe alſo ſayeth lorde haue wrought cace men muſte thinke haue happened caſualtie aduenture haue done ſayth lord seeing god ſpared ſuche prophete man indued ſuch excellencie led whole life ſounde vprightneſſe ſauing fall wife vrias god ſay vſed ſuch rigoure towardes dauid whome choſen ſhall ſpare whorhunters make continuall trade ordinarie art abuſing men wiues lie alwayes wayt bring wicked purpoſes aboute muſte needes feele iudge heauen ſuffer ſuche wyckedneſſe vnpuniſhed god therefore maketh ſuch reprochfulneſſe return vpon themſelues yet let vnderſtande receyue iuſte payment ſuche one haue deſerued let learne humble themſelues god furthermore heare threatned abuſe men wiues owne wiues alſo ſhall bee rauiſhed defiled god raiſe vp whoremonger execute iuſtice ought abate temptation ſuch haue feare god man haue • ſt feare god reaſon ſurely bee hild awe hearing ſuch threatening whereby god warneth therfore let euerie man make profite text ſeeing god abide ſuche loceneſſe let v praye gouerne v ſuch wiſe wicked affection may tamed wicked luſt may raigne v haue place v acceſſe vnto v marke one point furthermore let v marke alſo added concerning crime end thinke ſtraunge god ſhould puniſhe ſo roughly much wee alwayes would meaſure ſinnes owne meetyarde wee bring falſe ballance ſayd yeſterday would poſſible finde fault god accuſe ouer greate rigour puniſhing faultes cauſe ſayde muſt marke well howe iob addeth ouer great looceneſſe yea outrage worthy condemned burning fire deuour al thing euen destruction doth v vnderſtand muſt iudge whore dome common opinion men make ſport according ſee howe ſcoffers ieſt many deſpizers god heathniſhe folke make game men ſhall heare diueliſh blaſphemie veniall ſinne bee forgiuen ſuche thing theſe thing haue begon late dayes cauſe alſo paule hauing ſpoken expreſly whoredome ſaith freendes beware ye tempted vaine word reaſon ſuche thing wrath god commeth vpon vnbeleeuers sathan time imbrued worlde ſuch mockery whordome counted ſo horrible thing ought paule ſaith ſhall purpoſe mē bable flatter themſelues ſuch toyes god wrath ſhall neuertheleſſe haue courſe hee hath ſhewed time time cannot beare whordom truly ought marke firſt defile body whiche ought temple holie ghoſt ſins ſaieth paule committed ſuche wiſe ſoyle ſtaine abideth ſo much body mā ſoyle ſtaine whordome doth ſeemeth whore whoremonger would wither owne body beare ſhame diſhoneſtie god wee conſidered well whoredome men doe vnhalowe temple god holie ſpirite diſmember body lorde ieſus chriſt ſurely would abhor ſinne wee againe aduoutrie whordome matched togither peruerting al right equitie among mē mā rob another mā good ſhal puniſhed theef ſhalbe rebuked al men hand ſhal cried men ſpit face yet aduoutrie thā ſimple robberie therin men rob men good ſubſtance onely alſo honor honeſtie all▪ rob onely thoſe borne alſo thoſe vnfaſhioned mother wombes againe mariage holy league couenant lord nameth ſcripture man falſifie couenant made bargayning ſelling conueying ſome ſecrete title intereſt himſelfe ſuborning ſome falſe witneſſes ought bee puniſhed beholde cheefe couenaunt bee worlde broken falſifyed solemne declaration made faith husbande oweth wife wife hir husbande come church preſence god call vpon bee iudge eyther keepe promiſe hee hath made yet notwithſtanding commeth nothing conſidered theſe thing aright ſurely whore dome aduoutries ſhould ſuffred euerie man woulde abhorre yea would none would bridle ſelfe become owne iudge holde determination lawe rule anye ſo wicked could hilde feare god religion yet notwithſtanding ſhould feare thretning ſhort certaine men would bee zelous cutte ſuche euill amongſt v heereby ſee many make profeſsion goſpell thinke awhit told although thinke god ſpeaketh yet notwithſtanding moued sathan hath doted ſo ſtraught haue reaſon vnderſtanding therfore let v remember leſſon whiche conteyned heere wheras ſayd whoredome great looceneſſe wickedneſſe bee condemned let euerie v cite himſelfe god iudgement take heede keepe oure ſelues vndefiled bycauſe aboue ſtrength man ſo doe behoueth god worke v ſubduing wicked luſtes let v praye gouerne v ſo holie ſpirite wee may abhorre ſinne haue always eye vengeaunce ſpoken heere although god puniſhe whoremonger aduoutries ſort ſet yet let v aſſure ſelues hath diuers mean ſo eſcape hande man haue inueigled man wife god cauſe owne wife fall intoo like diſhoneſtie may come paſſe wicked mā ſhall haue vertuous wife god ſhall pitie hir ſo ſhee ſhall bee preſerued giue ouer hir ſelfe vnto euill though hir husbande bee wicked yet notwithſtanding let hir husbande therefore thinke hath made better market god ſhall well ynough finde ſome meanes let v vnderſtande hath chaſtizements inowe coffer according ſayde ſong moyſes hath terrible roddes vnknown vnto v bring forth ſo euer thinketh good therefore let v preuent iudgement feare ſtand awe ſeeing ſheweth v fauour warne v afore hand againe wee bee yet ſo retchleſſe conſider warning giuen v heere let v marke well holie ghoſt doubleth ſayde threatning ſaith fire deuoureth deſtruction plucketh vp wealth roote needes muſte men bee worſe brutiſhe leaſtwiſe doe waken ſayde looceneſſe ſinne deſerueth bee condemned fire conſumeth thing goeth euen roote vtter deſtruction ſuffereth ſubſtance tarie vnwiped away seeing wee heare god manaceth v ſuch wiſe end ſhould afrayd wrath high time bethinke ſelues nowe neuer furthermore let v practiſe doctrine two ſorts witte let euerie v profite ſelfe ſame manner ouer alſo let v indeuer much v lyeth euerie man according ſtate calling amend euill amongeſt people keepe oure ſelues pure touching fyrſte poynt let euerie v looke ſelfe keepe good watch ouer affection feare leaſt deceyued haue ſhewed heeretofore inough man keepe ſelfe deede vnleſſe hee ſet ſuch watch ouer eye hee haue vnchaſte lookes hee looketh vpon man wife wicked deſire alreadie condemned whoredome aduoutrie god ſhall become v goe heart ſhall become v proceed lying wayte watching deceyue men wiues much behoueth v bee vigilant watching ouer oure luſts much ſtubborne let euerie v bethinke ſelfe holde ſelfe awe vnder feare god alſo let v haue eye horrible threatning god maketh againſt whoredome zealous correct wee ſee raigne among v beare nouriſh negligence ſhall hild bawdes ruffian god man excuſe ſelfe hee purblind beetleblind behalfe ſuffereth whoredome committed cleare ſelfe bawde god haue ſaide alreadie much v lyeth wee doe heape vp fyrewoode god wrath seeing houſe whoremaſter muſt conſumed fire deuoure wee indeuer oure behalfe quenche ſtoppe whoredomes hauing full ſcope among v may bee commonly ſuffered fyre muſt need ſpread whole town whole countrey wee muſte needes feele god curſe vnderminding v till bee vtterly conſumed much expreſſe mention made iudges let ſuche haue charge office puniſhing ſinne looke wel themſelues ſhal double bawdes double ruffian god ſuffer whoredome ſlip eye themſelues couer make reckening rather contented ſhoulde continually haue ſcope thus yee ſee wee haue marke texte furthermore let v beware wee bee onely reſtreyned ſome forced feare committing outward acte whoredome ſo much god ſo gracious vnto v chooſe v bee temple holie ſpirite hath drawne v ſelfe let v pray graunt v grace ſerue pureneſſe bodie alſo mynde much graffed bodie lord ieſus chriſt hath knit v himſelf mēbers let v beware diſhonor defile ſelues ſuch filthineſſe ye ſee ſort faythfull ought induce ſelues chaſtitie forced feare knowing grace honour god hath done vnto hath pleaſed come vnto ſort therfore let deſire nothing ſo much come vnto meanes lord ieſus chriſte thus much concerning proteſtation iob maketh whoredome let v come ſecond proteſtation addeth ſo far taking away men goodes vſed pryde crueltie euē towards thoſe vnderlings menſeruants maid ſeruants thoſe day adays mē thē wage ſo bound couenant bondſlaues euen liue die men poſſeſſed aſſes ox well worthy noted although man lawe maiſter power life death ouer bondſlaue yet notwithſtanding ſee iob delt cace ſay reſtreined bridled himſelf bicauſe knew according god law thoſe haue ſuch ſuperioritie muſt abuſe play tyrant tread reaſonable creature vnder feete therefore ought marke well ſtate condition ſeruants time make v knowe better howe great iobs gentleneſſe vpright dealing taking libertie world gaue leaue ſaw lawfull doe god let v marke word vſeth • f • ſaith haue refuſed iudgement ſeruant maid ſtriued againſt word ſtriue vſeth ſignifieth quarell debate ſome variāce pleading iob meneth although hee might haue ſtopped mouthes men maides haue loden ſtripes liſted ſo none ſhuld haue durſt quetch againſt yet notwithſtanding giuen thē leaue plead good cace ſo although neuer ſo angrie yet ſeruantes reaſonable excuſe might freely debate matter ſhewe theirright ſo hee oppreſſe force vvee ſee pride crueltie ſheweth therewithall howe hee able maſter affection ſuch wiſe could gentle bearing inferiours ſayth made made alſo wee faſhioned one may taken faſhioned one wombe ſay wee come adam one nature howbeit muſt yet extende iob conſidered two thing hee bare ſo gently ſeruantes firſte wee haue one common creator come one god alſo wee one nature ſo muche bee concluded men thoughe bee neuer ſo baſe degree deſpyzed worlde neuertheleſſe brother diſdayneth acknowledge man brother muſt make ſelfe oxe lion beare ſome wilde beaſt diſclaim image god imprinted v lo heere two reaſons iob alledgeth thervpon concludeth ſhall god commeth viſit ſhould lyft vp ſelfe mee might able ſtande face ſhould call life acc •• nt coulde aunſwere haue beene churliſhe ſeruauntes lo heere texte importeth verie great profitable doctrine ſo bee wee vſe well wee ought bee ſo gentle towardes oure inferior lyeth hand oppreſſe muſt oure owne accorde bee lawe meaſure rule ſelues howe gentle ought towardes equalles ſeemeth man ſubiect vnto may vſe ſuche authoritie ouer hee ſhall ſpeake may liſt according wee ſee men beare ſelues hand may much may god giue inch authoritie take el ſo ther ho meaſure ſurely behoueth v ſpare thoſe inferior aboue god hath aduanced vs▪ muſt haue deal equal ſuperiors maſter ſhall condemned god oppreſſe ſeruant violence ſo preſumptuous ſtately abyde ſeruant ſhould defend ſelfe good quarel ſhall become ſeruant bee ſtubborne againſt maiſter vvhat ſhall become child ſetteth himſelfe againſt father ſubiect riſeth againſt soueraine surely theſe thing leſſe bee borne withall ſee wee heere generall doctrine cōmon men firſt ſuch aduaunced authoritie muſt knowe god ſetting ſtate giue bridle vex others trample vnder fete behoueth refraine ſelues alwayes lowlyneſſe myldneſſe marke one poynt authoritie amongſt men ought haue ſuche preheminence ſerueth lowe degree ſhould therefore deſpized true man ſhould maiſter owne houſe ſouereintie ſo noble therefore man woulde looke haue ſelfe heard obeyed owne houſe neuertheleſſe wee ſee maiſter hath ſuch power ouer men maydes hee ought heare paciently wrong done mā ought vſe ſuch gentleneſſe towards vnderlings owne houſe ought ſuch haue authoritie iuſtice haue ſuch power maſters haue ouer ſeruants haue honorable authoritie preheminence lord ouer mē ſo others ſhould bondage nay rather let king prince flatter themſelues neither let beare ſelues hand world made thē rather made multitude hath god ſtabliſhed principality kingdom common welfare aduaunce two three onely aboue reſt ende ſhould ſome order ſtate gouernement among men therefore king prince ought beware liue ſuche wiſe ouer subiectes miſuſe execute tyrannie ouer ſhall much leſſe excuſeable mayſters deale cruelly ſeruants muche leſſe libertie haue whiche called ſtate iuſtice ſet god officer yelde euerie man right ſuch forget ſelues bee caried awaye pryde god muſt needes puniſh roughly maſters haue doone outrage wrong brother ſerued furthermore ſo ſuch haue authoritie ouer others muſt exalte ſelues vvhat ſhall equall ſtate ought euerie one v liue neighboure man exalte ſelfe whereas hee ought acknowledge ſelfe equall fellowe like ſo hee playeth bull praye muſte ſuche pryde bee tamed man hath nothing headie raſhneſſe woulde take vpon ſuch anthoritie ouer neighbour hee vouchſafe looke vpon askew beare ſelfe hande worlde ought quake looke ſhould god ſet hande ſuche braueries let v marke well ſtreine ſerueth onely teach mildneſſe gentleneſſe vnto maſters alſo much dutie men generall therefore ſee god haue inferior ſuffer indure ſuche haue authoritie ouer behoueth euerie v loke owne ſtate calling learne frame ſelues vnto ſuch mildeneſſe neither maiſter oppreſſe ſeruaunt ſeruaunt ſtriue againſte maiſter euerie man ſo diſcharge owne duetie god may ſerued aboue thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreine conuicte v perchaunce ſo farre wit euerie v woulde take vpon belongeth vnto let v marke wee fall bee ſo proude become ſo cruell towardes thoſe vnder v ſhall onely condemned mouth god prophet alſo verie heathen men muſt iudges laſt day ſayde euen nowe lawes man mayſter thoſe dayes power lyfe death ouer ſeruantes ſayde heathen men thereof becommeth v vſe ſeruantes hireling ſaye folke wee haue taken wage though vnderlings theſe owne wordes vnbeleeuers time ſuch regarde humanitie ſeemed euerie man ought bridle ſelfe euen althoughe hee free libertie giuen doe liſted ſeruants pray excuſe v inlightned god word haue ſuch conſideration leaſt let v marke god aduaunce v authoritie trie oure modeſtie hee giue v men ſeruantes mayde ſeruants vnder v end inure v humanitie vpright dealing ſpoken heere end ſhould ſhewe god haue ſhewed v ſpeciall fauour ought thinke ſelues beholden meanes thereof prouoked vſe ſoberly ſeing hath power ouer v doth neuertheleſſe ſpare v behoueth v follow willingly child reſemble goodneſſe towardes others furthermore man vnder coloure authoritie vaunt ſelfe cruelly againſt others let v aſſure oure ſelues power vtterly peruerſe yea ſay ſigne ouer malicious nature man aduaunceth himſelfe ſort reaſon credite contrariwiſe certaine ſuch myld louing nature alwayes ſpare inferiours authoritie god giueth reſtreyned yea euen owne accord heere ſpeaking conſtraint commeth men lyke thoſe play lyamhoundes vſe kynde flatterie able doe nothing afterwardes ouerpaſſe bound aduaunced ſhewing ſelues haue myldeneſſe ſlauiſh nature counted villanous deteſtable thing ought induce v myldeneſſe holie ghoſt commaundeth v ſtreine cheefe thing well bearing away two reaſons haue touched heretofore wit haue one maker whome v come one like nature thus yee ſee wee haue conſider beate downe pryde crueltie v tempted therevnto man haue houſehold god hath giuen menſeruantes maydſeruants tempted vſe vnmeaſurable rigour againſt let ſeeke remedie ſhewed v heere howe handle ſeruants cruelly ſo plucke breade mouthes dare eate one morſell feare leaſt ſhould grudge holde harde laboure bee ſhort ſhewe ſelfe vnmercifull churliſh towardes againſt whome doe ſet ſelfe true mine therewithal hath god created faſhioned thē haue one common maiſter heauen reaſon saint paule alledgeth hee exhorteth maiſters beare ſeruants freendes ſayth hee although ye haue ſuperioritie ouer yet haue alſo maiſter heauen ſuche exalted ceaſſe therfore ſubiects god aboue therfore let beare mind muſt render accoūt gaue ſeruants muſt needes reſtreyned haue conſideration haue wee oure ſelues righte come ſuperioritie euery v hath owne behalfe pawne god hathe put hand keepe ought well aduiſed may vſe according heathē men themſelues intended frame king prince conformitie skill inough ſay true king make thēſelues feared redoubted yet ſcape hand heauenly iudge ther god aboue verified prince whiche higheſt ſuperioritie ſhal become thoſe whiche mean authoritie maiſters miſtreſſes▪ furthermore ſayde let v conſider haue v one maker wee conſider wee deſcended one god wee muſt need conclude true namely oppreſſe neyghbours god muſt offended therefore let man exalte ſelfe vanitie salomon ſaith hee mocketh blinde poore deſpizeth maker nowe poore man deſpize put ſome ſhame true wrong firſt offered mortall man yet doth god ſteppe betwixt v taketh iniurie done himſelfe thus yee ſee iob rather holie ghoſt ment betoken ſtreine ſayth created mayſter created ſeruant alſo wee bee touched vayne preſumption ſet ſelues men couet ſuch ſuperioritie euery man ſhould ſtoupe v caſt himſelfe feete wee ſelues haue full ſcope let v come conſideration ſaying yea although bee mayſter god hath made ſeruant hath faſhioned well mee vvhen wee thinke ſort qnayle ouerweening ſo hautineſſe ſhall bee repreſſed herewithall alſo let v haue ſeconde regard ſpoken heere namely bee one ſelfeſame nature true god hath alſo ſhaped brute beaſtes tree thing hath ſhaped men faſhion brute beaſts hee hath giuen men vnderſtanding printed image contrarie parte looke vpon another muſt needes ſee ſelfe looking glaſſe ſeeing god hath knit ſuche knot betwixte v pray doth hee goeth breake cut himſelfe mankinde doth hee deſerue bee caſt vp among dogges ſeeing acknowledgeth nature whiche god hath put v yes verie fewe thinke theſe thinges contrariwiſe yee ſhall ſee man bee exalted one finger heigth hee beareth himſelfe hande hee ſtate men therefore ſo muche need haue marke well doctrine thoſe dayes ther yet ſuch light iob vnderſtood ſeeing god maker v hath ſet v one ranke ſame ought correct pryde men pull downe highe lookes highe ſtomackes praye excuſe ſhall wee haue day god ſheweth ſelfe bee father ſaith creator men well poore riche ſeruauntes well mayſters alſo nameth himſelfe father therefore behoueth v haue brotherhoode amongſt v vnleſſe wee renounce name god cutte oure ſelues houſe ſteade beeing houſeholde vvee ſee howe ieſus chriſt lord glorie abaced ſelfe ſo lowe become ſeruant ſeruantes alſo wee haue one common heritage wherevnto called saint paule ſayth ſeing ſo let v learne humble ſelues therwithall knowe pryde crueltie doe ſhut v gate paradiſe vvherefore let v gentle curteous towardes thoſe ouer whome wee haue ſuperioritie ſeeing oure lorde auoucheth bee child wee may bee gathered altogither ſuche ſorte god may glorified v great ſmall wee followe ſuch order euerie v maye diſcharge dutie according calling v yeelde honoure great lorde mayſter common iudge v ſo let v fal face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying receyue v mercie therewithall plucke v back ſuch wiſe himſelf may deſire nothing ſubmit ſelues wholy vnto notwithſtanding authoritie giueth well one v another ouer men yet may conſider one mutuall bond among v one v ſubiect another end diſcharge ſelues dutie walk ſuch ſort brotherly vnitie may v one cōmon accord one mouth claim father ſo let v al ſay almightie god c cxiiij sermon fourth vpon xxxj chapter 16 haue diſappoynted poore deſire haue vveryed eye vvidovve 17 haue eaten morſels alone fatherleſſe hath part thereof 18 youth hee hath beene brought vp vvere father ſhee hathe beene vvith vvombe mother 19 haue ſeene man periſh vvant coate poore vvant garment 20 loynes haue bliſſed mee haue beene vvarmed vvith fleece lambes 21 haue lift vp hande againſt fatherleſſe ſeeing helpe gate 22 let mine arme fall ſhoulder let mine arme broken bone 23 haue feared puniſhment god could beare burthen heere iob ſheweth manner louingneſſe hee ſuccoure poore needie proteſted heeretofore done man wrong paſſeth yet namely pitying neceſsitie ſuche came ſuccoure hee releeued owne goodes ſubſtaunce yea euen without making linger vvherein ſheweth himſelfe haue willing forwardneſſe ſaye hee ſooner requeſted employed ſelfe delayed day day thoſe loue lugged eare cauſe ſayth haue diſappoynted poore deſire ſay ſuccoured poore ſawe want needie haue weryed eye widowe wee wayte anything longing eye alwayes vpon wee looke ouer earneſtly vpon anye thing oure eye faynte dazel vvee ſee howe iobs meening hung downe groyne boſome ſay poore folkes came deſire help ſuccoured hand alſo hee addeth hee ſawe men ſterue colde wanted rayment rather delt ſo loynes ſides bliſſed ſay felt fauour whiche ſhewed warmed fleece lambes ſhort ſayth eaten morſells alone deuoured himſelfe goodes god giuen giuen widowes fatherleſſe part whome ſayth haue brought vp father vvherein doth v wit bin father fatherleſſe mother womb ſayth haue widow haue taken vntoo mee poore needed ſuctour haue neuer fayled bee ſo let ſhoulders fall ſocket ſay let bee diſmembred let fall peeces like rotten carren let mine arme ſayth thrust ioynt let bone broken let world ſee god great horrible curſe vppon body ſayeth hee haue done wrong thoſe feeble able reuenge themſelues like haue lifted vp hand againſt fatherleſſe although able wrong help ſhoulde haue mās hand iuſtice might vphold wrong yet notwithſtanding haue attempted ſuch thing lette torne peeces rot aliue ſo alwayes afrayd god ſcourge able beare burthen herein declareth hath done heeretofore reſpect men ſhame world conſideratiō lifted euill foraſmuch ſaw god hys iudge therefore walked vprightly althoughe hee might haue gone vnpuniſhed worldward without feare purſued way iuſtice otherwiſe might haue taken libertie doo harme meaner ſort reaſon credit yet notwithſtanding hee always conſideration ſay verely god knowe thy wrath would terrible vnto ſhuld ibe able indure ſhort iob ſheweth heere abſteyning ſinne feare puniſhment ſawe none eye conſciēce ſake whiche compelled obey god feare iudgement come effect whyche conteyned heere firſt haue heere one leſſon ſhew god child wee muſt pitiful help neighbor need almes deedes therefore commended v heere hath bin tolde often heeretofore word almes importeth much mercy ſee among tytles god chalengeth vnto himſelfe gentle mercifull wee bee child neyther acknowledge v ſuch except labour follow example behalfe namely moued pitie ſee poore folke aduerſitie go prouide euery v according abilitie true may giue ſubſtance yet ſhal counted vertue hand opened giue behoueth hart bee touched cōpaſsion haue pitie thoſe aduerſitie behoueth v alſo ſuccour power iames ſayth ſay apoore man freend god help thee thereby ſhew haue loue ſay great pitie man yet meane whyle labour ſuccour whome ought releeue mockerie hypocrite ſay ſee god ſheweth mee pitifull cace much god gaue mee occaſion imploy ſelfe thereby ſee hee calleth yet meane make countenance one drop kindneſſe • would indeuer help ſuch neceſsitie part wee haue beare mind text holy ghoſt exhorteth v almes deedes ſame conſiſteth two poynts ſay pitifull towards neighbour ſee aduerſitie alſo haue ſuch pitifull affection ſeeke meanes ſuccour euery man ſtreyneth himſelf power true cannot ſtead neceſsities wee ſee therefore chriſtian man may well mourne heart without putting hys hand purſe impoſsible euen beſt minded help time therefore pitifulneſſe ſhall ſuffiſe god accepteth almes deede poore nouriſhed fedde haue compaſsion vpon poore man great ſacrifice vnto god hee gyuen delt dole full purſe neuertheleſſe behoueth v alwayes looke deale according habilitie knowing lord hath made v stewardes goodes hath put hand end euery v ſhould deuoure himſelf alone ſhould communicate ſuche haue neede true alſo man ſet certaine ſtint cace ſurely saint paule ſpeaketh ſayeth god conſtreyneth v neceſsitie haue v free deuotion way let v beare well minde poore paſſe v ſee neede keepe purſes ſhet ſo vouchſafe ſuccour ſure ſigne wild beaſts ther one mite pitie v ſelues ſhal one day feele like vnmercifulneſſe god ſend v affliction although miſerable yet ſhall man moued men ſhall looke vpon v diſdaine ſo ſhall bee ſhaken left vtterly deſtitute meaſure wage god wonte giue vnto ſuch hardharted towards neybours according ſayd hee mercileſſe ſhall haue iudgemente without mercie yea beſides men ſhall cruell towards v according deſerts wee muſt alſo end appeare god handle v rigour bycauſe wee haue folowed goodneſſe would haue rule example much behoueth v bee mindfull doctrine whiche ſhewed v namely god thinketh ynough wee ſhould abſteyne euill hurting neighbour frō taking away men goodes ſubſtance true already kinde vertue wee iuſtly proteſt haue cleane handes giuen theeuerie deceyte extortion yet let v thinke wee cleare quitte god giuen v wherewith help ſuch haue neede blameworthey haue taken away god good put another vſe ment ſeruant bee put truſt receyue maſters goodes mayſter hath appoynted giue thus much ſuch one pay ſuch ſumme money oweth haue ſet ordinarie ſorte hee haue goodes ſpent ſeruant play niggarde ſo one man commeth cry pay yet hee wyll part wyth pennie another commeth ſaying mayſter willeth giue mee ſuche thing yet let thing go houſholde cryeth oute vppon hym breade hee letteth ſterue hunger labour maiſters ſeruice pray tollerable ſeruant ſhall anſwere beholde ſir haue touched one mite goodes beholde ſir haue reſerued vnto euer mayſter maye ſay ſhame haue put goodes intoo thy hande ende thou haſt done ſhame thou haſt beſtowed goodes appoynted thee nowe muſt beare ſlaunder thy niggardſhip pinching none thine mayſter ſhall commen ſuche ſeruaunt ſhall hee condemne wicked lykewiſe god gyueth v hys goodes intent wee ſhould relieue oure brother nowe contrary parte wee bee ſo ſtrayght laced goeth penie purſes one morſell bread table ſhall become v defrauding whome god hath ordeyned haue part ſubſtance robbing god thing hee hath put intoo oure handes ſayd afore let v learne bee mercifull although man taske v ſay thou ſhalte gyue thus much yet neuertheleſſe let euery man ſtreyne hymſelfe conſider hys owne abilitie knowing well wee haue done doo yet wee diſcharged thus yee ſee particular lawe euery man ought haue charitie ought ſtretche ſelfe farre wide euen ſo farre wee may ſtill confeſſe ſelues bee ſufficiently diſcharged towardes poore wee poſsible althoughe wee come full perfection ſo bee niggardlyneſſe grudging free heart ſuccour ſuche haue neede let v aſſure ſelues oure lorde accepteth almeſſe ſacrifice ſweete ſauour yea euen though ſome faultineſſe wee tenth part bound heerewithall behoueth v marke circumſtance whiche ſet downe heere wee cauſe ſuche linger haue neede vſe ſuch delay token wee haue free hart neighbor good wee put another time exceprit bee vpon good conſideration may well bee man maye bee pitifull yet notwithſtanding inquire neceſsitie partie lingring whiche iob meeneth hee ſayeth hee diſappoynted poore man hys deſire heere hee intendeth expreſſe lothneſſe niggardes namely man deſireth reliefe woulde fayne draw penie purſes ſeeming man would plucke guttes belly therefore woulde alwayes fayne haue ſome releaſe like vnto yll paymayſter men come demaund dette knoweth well muſt pay yea well able doth good bragge money purſe day twayne elſe like man led hanging delayeth long hee commeth mounting vp ladder falleth preaching euery ſtoppe euen ſo play theſe holdfaſtes man cōmeth demand hys det maketh alwayes ſhrinke backe much man come aske almes wee charitable ſurely ſhould haue lothneſſe v ſhoulde ſeeke ſuche reſpites poore ſhould linger afore v ſuche wiſe wee ſhoulde haue oure eares beaten euer cry wee would indeuer helpe preſently much lay v ye ſee wee haue remember thys ſtreyne namely wee wyll almes acceptable vnto god wee muſt tary till wee bee importunatly called cried vpon ſee neede muſt hie v take order preſently like wee ſelues indure aduerſitie ſeemeth v men ſhall neuer come time ynough ſuccour v deale wee likewiſe others vvee neede take none meaſure true naturall rule vnto others woulde bee done vnto haſtie deſire ſuccour piteouſly ſlow giue yee ſee cauſe wee ought better marke ſaying iob made widow linger diſappointed poore hys deſire nowe addeth eaten morſels alone giuen fatherleſſe widowe part vvhy ſo ſayth haue brought vp widowe mother wombe haue nouriſhed fatherleſſe father heere wee ſee woonderfull example buontifulneſſe liberalitie heere dooing ſome little almes deede weeke three foure iob declareth heere hee beene father fatherleſſe defender wydowes onely helping alſo finding hys goodes ſubſtance vvhen wee heare pray ought wee greatly aſhamed vvee hardly ſcarcely finde oure harte ſuccour one among hundred ſo wee miſſe whole ſcore tymes yet thynke ſelues well diſcharged ſome lighte almes ſome one man prouide requiſite giuing ſome little peece coyne paſſe wee woulde ſay go ſhifte thy ſelfe ſome otherwhere great ſhame v iob ſhould giuen v heere mirrour perſone lorde ſhoulde ſhewe v duetie yet notwithſtanding wee nothing yet whiche conteyned heere ought ſerue oure learning inſtruction contrariwiſe ſerueth condemne v inſomuche ſhall neede none recorde god reproue v beaſtly crueltie leaſtwiſe folow ſhewed v heere iob true although wee haue perfection yet god fayle accept v haue ſaid inſomuch althoughe almes deedes ſuch ought yet god take good woorth ſo haue ſaid compaſsion towards ſuch diſtreſſe indeuer good cheerefull mind meane cannot match iob full ſhall therefore follow shall wee leaſtwiſe labour aloofe faſhion ſelues example shall wee go towarde ſame marke vvell able bring vp fatherleſſe yea though wee haue wherewith yet oure infirmitie holdeth v backe imploying ſelues vttermoſt yet leaſt ought haue ſome compaſſion let v ſomewhat though although wee cannot attaine marke iob came vnto leaſtwiſe let v trauel towards ſeeing god calleth v great ſhame nothyng elſe remoue one legge grinde teeth theſe loyterers doo ſet forward one foote thinke draw whole mountaine againe lifted vp one arme frowne grinde teeth ſtead putting forward pull backward vvhen go worke faſhion token willingneſſe v therefore cannot come ſuch perfection iob declareth himſelfe haue whiche thing hee declareth way bragging intente ſhould moued let v leaſtwiſe follow example god knowing wee become neuer better ſingle teaching ſetteth v foorth looking glaſſes end ſhould haue leſſe excuſe man aske muſt wee giue men withoute difference anſwer heereto holy ghoſt intendeth take awaye diſcretion almes gyuing ſo men ſhoulde looke well beſtowing ſhould go without diſcretion euery man ſhould drawne drie end poore ſhould left ſuccourleſſe boldeſt woulde beare away manner men boldeſt leaſt pitied counterfeyte themſelues bee poore onely rake themſelues onely ſeeking haue double treble care though men ſuffer hunger thirſt therefore good men ſhoulde vſe diſcretion looke narowly whome gyue ſpecially conſidering lewdeneſſe dayes worlde ſo many hypocrite pitie ſee hardly ſhall man finde one amongſt hundred woorthy bee ſuccoured although bee poore deede yet notwithſtanding men loth good bycauſe ſoone get thing fall gluttonie drunkenneſſe ſo god maketh waſt away ſhort come full meaſure iniquitie inſomuch ought vſe great diſcretion narrowe ſearch wee gyue meane whyle let v beware ſeeke couert niggardlyneſſe vnder ſhadowe diſcretion god miſliketh men ſhoulde haue regarde whome gyue ende benefite may bee well beſtowed behoueth v firſt bee fully reſolued maner ourſelues mynde ſpare according meaſure haue doo good according abilitie deſire finde may ſuccour vvhen man ſo reſolued let hym inquire whither almes may well beſtowed man man may freely man ſay himſelfe beſt wel aduiſed giue always take occaſion excuſe ſay find pouerty ſo hee glad haue ſome occaſion ſtay giuing appeareth manifeſtly ſuch man ſeeketh nothing exempte himſelfe releeuing thoſe haue need help intend inquire behoueth good go ſay ſeeking doo good let v boldly inquire may well ſo firſt formoſt well minded ſeeke couert niggardlineſſe thus ye ſee poynt muſt come yet notwithſtanding ſearching alſo muſt bee narrowly impoſsible wee ſhould deceyued well although wee beſt trie thyngs yet notwithſtanding wee muſte needes ouerſeene giuing ſome almes ſuch vnwoorthy cauſe saint paule exhorteth v good without ceaſsing ſhall haue many lettes hinder v firſt ſhall ſee ſome malicious perſons miſreport v therevpon follow vnthankefulneſſe whiche dealing able thruſt v way yet muſt alwayes good courage holde ſtill whatſoeuer come bee ſhort according haue ſayde already wee cannot ſet downe particular rule thing generall rule whiche god giueth v ought ſuffiſe v wee muſt haue kinde harte inclined pitie compaſsion deſire benefite ſuccour ſuch haue neede helpe muſt make linger wayting vpon v rather haue playne meening heart ende hand may open whenſoeuer neede requireth thus ye ſee effect haue beare away heere let v marke well iob
