addeth immediately hee ſeene hym periſh • whiche wanted clothes ſuffered hym ſterue colde rayment couer ſydes loynes ſayth hath bleſſed mee beene warmed fleece ſheepe heere iob ſheweth laboured kynde wayes almes deedes giuing meate drinke ſuche ahungred athirſt alſo clothing naked truely wee intende mercifull behoueth v ſuccour neceſsities neighbour ſuch ſorte ſee ynough ſuccour part true men cannot doo iob dyd wee haue ſo many thouſandes cattell hee might haue bin accounted amongſt great prince theſe dayes reſpect reuenue according ſee onely yoke hundred ox whole droues yea many coulde kept fiue ſixe village rather whole countrey muche haue ſeene well ynough ſubſtance onely cattell cattell whole countrey euery man therefore cannot attaine howſoeuer world go let v conſider owne abilitie according vnto behoueth v indeuer doo good like know ſaide widowe whiche gaue two mite prayſed commended chriſt ſuch caſt great ſummes money reaſon bycauſe ſhe giuen hir whole ſubſtaunce whereas others giuen ſmall portion reſpect rich let euery one v conſider owne ſtate ſee neighbour want eyther meate drinke clothes leaſtwiſe able ſuccour otherwiſe let v pray god haue pitie vpon help therewithall wiſe let ther fault v ayded ſuccoured ye ſee haue beare mind iob ſpoken meate delt part hungrie addeth alſo hee clothed ſuche ſhould haue ſterued cold bin help yea ſayth loynes bliſſed vvherein declareth occaſion cun thanke releeued ſort therewithal ſheweth v looked reward men hand ſought diſcharged god ward good glad good done bicauſe knew acceptable god leſſon ought beare well mind although men vnthankful towards v ſuch haue done good vnto grudge againſt v render v euill good yet notwithſtanding wee haue loſt thing good ſpite teeth belly bliſſe v god haue fed haue ſuccoured otherwiſe thing ſelfe anſwer v true ſometimes wil ſo malicious ſay yea mary much purpoſe wherefore beholding according wee ſee nowadayes pooreſt proudeſt ſuch man hath indeuered good vnto wil ſooneſt ſpeake euill ſhall ſee let v therefore bee wery cannot away ſuch vnthākfulneſſe let v marke ſaying ſet downe heere thing haue done ſhall bliſſe v god man playeth verlet grudgeth murmureth another man hathe helped verywell yet doth carie ſides ſtill man haue clothed body muſte needes bliſſe god true hath ſuch intent howſoeuer fare god loketh vppon body clothed bliſſedneſſe ſhall come account man haue bin fed ſaid belly muſt needes ſpeake although mouth churliſh ſo turne good euill nothing commeth poyſon yet notwithſtanding lord accept bliſſedneſſe almes deede man ſhall haue done thus ye ſee end may prouoked ſuccour ſuch haue neede v haue marke wee muſt reſpect whether able recompence v counteruayle good ſhall done whether ſuch thankfull put cace cleane contrary yet ſhall haue loſt labour bycauſe god accepteth ſacrifice done ye ſee imported ſaying ſydes loynes man nipped colde doo bliſſe ſuche haue clothed contrary part let v marke although poore aske vengeance againſt v cō playne v yet notwithſtanding ſides curſe v ſuffering ſmart ſhet eye haue pitie ſay mine eaſe care howe othermen fare wee haue bene ſo cruell harted certayne wee vouchſafe ſuccour poore needie ſterue want reliefe god wil make ſides loynes ſpeake althoughe party themſelues open mouthes cōplain vnmercifulneſſe yet notwithſtanding anguiſh ſuffer crieth complayneth god vengeance enſueth according complainte ſhall come ſo paſſe although men ſpeake worde haue ſayd afore iob hath ſpoken ſo addeth hee lifted vp hand fatherleſſe though ſaw help gate ſay although could haue done without puniſhment men thoſe time men ſate iuſtice gate townes place moſt reſort iob ſayth truly coulde haue made one man quake another run away could haue bin thunder amongſt man ſhoulde haue opened lip againſt vvhy ſo man credit ſhall bee borne folke ſhall dare complaine iudges ſhall dare redreſſe although full ſway iuſtice would haue ſuffered attempted yet notwithſtanding abuſed credite neyther dyd trample poore folke vnder feete fatherleſſe child ſought profit ſelfe know fatherleſſe child oftentimes put ſpoyle iob ſheweth ſuch vpright minde coulde haue taken away men goodes neuer went neuer ment make owne aduauntage men coſt though libertie man behalfe howbeit addeth reaſon ſayth hee god puniſhing caſting downe men made afrayde hee ſhoulde ſay dyd reſpect whether men would ſpeake euill onely hilde mine eye faſt vpon god heauenly iudge heere wee ſee firſt hath bin great corruption time ſuch men haue bene ordeyned yeeld euery man right haue diſcharged duetie therin new thing iudges nowadayes reach hand wicked ſort bolſtring bearing wickedneſſe hath alwayes bene ordinarie cuſtome therefore ſuche ſtate iuſtice ought looke better themſelues diſcharge dutie god corruption hath reigned long time day hath full ſcope euer man ſay maketh matter ſeeyng miſcheef hath bin ſo great antiquitie truely excuſed alſo ſuch knowledge god time neither men ſo well acquainted doctrine bee nowadayes vvherefore nowe ſit ſeate iuſtice haue mace hande ſuffer extortion ſee poore man troden vnder foote make account winke men authoritie take vppon becommeth thē excuſe ther ſeeing eares dayly beaten admonition warning told dutie toward god toward people cōmitted vvherfore let v marke vpon doctrine ſuche corruption ordinarily worlde iudges ſupported wicked behoueth v comforte euery man himſelf ſee like confuſion day muſtnot greeue v ouermuch though getneither right reaſon againſt ſuche v wrong able bring matter ſtandeth v hand armed pacience ſee hathe beene god exerciſe ſeruaunts ſorte time could well haue ſtabliſhed iuſtice time iob many poore folkes ſhould ſmart vvhereas like cace day intendeth meanes teach v ſuffer marke one poynt yet neuertheleſſe behoueth thoſe ſeate iuſtice looke well themſelues inaſmuch men inclined vice ſhall ſoone bee thruſt duetie take good heede according wee ſee many example alſo ſecond leſſon whiche behoueth v remember wee reſpect lawfull v worldward ſettle ſight vppon god example iob ſo feare may withhold v hurting wronging neighbour leſſon needefull pray men regard nowadayes may ſcape reproofe menne ynough man bring matter paſſe meane ſeaſon order iuſtice euen ſuch tyme iob ayd gate ſuch extortion ſuch deuoured widowes ſuche troubled poore folkes ala nowadayes come ſame extremitie muche woorſe inſomuch poore man troden downe ſhall haue redreſſe take away men good beguile▪ beate trouble poore folkes ouerſhoote themſelues intoo wickedneſſe lawleſſe perſons growne ſuche boldneſſe thynke lawe reſtreyne againe magiſtrates ſide fearefuller woman ſtoutneſſe god ſpirite elſe contented diſſemble pleaſure men yea halfe agree wicked although knowe thing go amiſſe yet notwithſtandyng haue zeale repreſſe yet worſe ſeeke nothyng ſhoulde bee oute ſquare worlde ſhoulde come ſuch extremitie euill ſhoulde bee feare god honeſtie thing elſe confuſion lo poynt moſt part men thinke nothing may ſcape haue done amiſſe looke vpon royſter lyeth wayte men goodes warrant bee meanes trappe hee eſpieth yea hee muſt come account tuſh may bribe ſuch man ſayth hee matter diſpatched carie preſent ſuch thing win hart ſhall win two three mo againe ſuch thing ſhall bee ſure fourth may make vp halfe doſen ſide matter crie see howe haue ſworde iuſtice hand ſet ſale lyke brothel ſo haue ſhame regard honour thing elſe nowadayes ſhiftes pretende ſhall ſo villaynous ſhal colur honeſtie vve ſee ſo euery man taketh leaue rob poll oppreſſe commital maner extortion matter brought iuſtice marred therefore ſentence well woorthy bee noted iob proteſteth notwithſtanding credit authoritie men ſtoode ſuch awe euen iudges themſelues durſt haue delt although ther bin complaint made yet hee abſteyned hys owne accord euill concluded wyth himſelfe might therefore thing bycauſe men permitted alwayes ſaying bridle wit god puniſhments made afrayd therefore let v learne walke ſoundneſſe good conſcience intend thing let v examine whether god permit ſee diſpleaſeth god ſo hath forbidden diſalowed let v let alone although men ſooth v yea giue v libertie liſt yet let v keepe ſelues behoueth v come heauenly iudge ſhall auayle v haue eſcaped hand men ſhall bee doubling vengeance bycauſe ſhew well deedes feare men god ſee wee offer heynous iniury preferring mortall creature wretched carions hys maieſtie ſhall afrayd men meane mocke god maieſtie ſhall nothing mee againe haue corrupted iuſtice eyther hatred fauour ſome crooked meanes ſo wee haue woon iudges ſee yee yet ſeconde outrage offer vnto god defiling hath halowed iuſtice holy thing vnhalow whē turne thoſe vnto euill ſet ſeate whome god hathe appoynted purpoſe authoritie name ſhould ſhine ſay go thruſt aſide poynte high treaſon god cauſe ſayd double god wrath vpon v ſhifting oure ſelues men handes ſort yee ſee wee muſt faſten eye vppon god looke vntoo hys iudgement intent may owne free accord refrayne euill wee may although ſame bee permitted v men behalfe therewithall alſo lette v marke fearing god puniſhment muſt onely feele come v late man feele god iudge ſtriken hande therefore let v afrayde god threatneth v ſtrokes light vpon head ye ſee euery man may refrayn euill eye fayth foreſee puniſhments farre prepared euill doer ſuche trouble neighbour god ſhe weth v great fauour warneth v aforehande end might preuent vengeance thus ye ſee haue beare mynd concluſion iob addeth ſhall beare burthen ſhew v thing ſpoken v apoſtle namely right dreadfull thing fall hand liuing god vvee afrayd men puniſhments touch body done fire god wrath whyche conſumeth thing yet neuer goeth burneth ſuch wiſe muſt forced continue yea indure without end vvhy regard wee let v moued puniſhment god let v looke keepe ſelues euill ſhame puniſhment world let v conſider well mind vnderſtandyng let v aſſure ſelues men ſhall haue determined execute cruelleſt torment vpon v deuiſed yet notwithſtanding nothing compariſon god heauie vengeaunce though man layde vpon wheele nipped pinſons burned aliue notwithſtanding theſe bee greeuous torment yet paſſe away continue euer againe grieue body beholde wrath god whiche conſumeth thinges flaming fire burneth without ende worme gnaweth biteth hart within vvhen ſcripture vſeth ſuch ſimilitudes expreſſe full onely giue v ſome little inckling therefore let v marke well vengeance god prepared wicked intollerable burthen let ſame prouoke v walke feare pacience aſſuring ſelues men vſe crueltie violence againſt v iudge heauen reuenge wherefore let ſame reſtreyne v euill doyng though may ſafely worldly reſpect let v take heede conſcience pure knowledge god rule guide v let v alwayes looke vpward behold hath ſet v world declaring vntoo v wee muſt one day come account iudgement ſeate nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying hym make v feele ſuch wiſe wee may craue forgiueneſſe ſo ſory may indeuer ſelues wholy amend profit day day obedience vntill fully reformed pitying ſuch neceſsitie may indeuer ſuccour like minded vntoo praying oure good god haue pitie vpon ſuccour v alſo although wee vnworthy yet notwithſtanding ſeing hath already made v feele goodneſſe mercie may doubt beſtowe vpon v increaſe grace day day v flee help true humilitie according hee calleth allureth v dayly vntoo word may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo c cxv sermon fift vpon xxxj chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon 21 22 23 verſes vpon text added heere 24 haue ſet hart vpon gold haue ſayd vvedge golde thou art hope 25 reioyced rich bycauſe hand found abundance 26 haue looked vp ſhining sunne moone vvalking hir brightneſſe 27 hart hath beene deceyued ſecret hand hath come mouth 28 vvere damnable vvickedneſſe denyed god aboue yeſterday wee ſawe proteſtation iob made concerning vpright walking feare men bycauſe eye alwayes vpon god knowing iudge men behoueth v come make account ſayd expreſly truſted owne credite ſuch fooliſh imagination make himſelfe feared riche men doo haue wherewith ſo greater ſorte alwayes puffed vp pride ſee poorer ſort ſuch cannot reuēge themſelues troden vnder foote turmoiled men thē wrong iniurie ſhame iob ſayeth abſteyned iniurie towards men gone euil bicauſe knew hee coulde eſcape hande god vvherevpon haue ſhew euill bee bolſtered heere bilowe behoueth v vſe pacience ſeeing hath alwayes bin god exerciſe ſeruants ſort wit ſhould ſuffer many outrage mainteyned good right iuſtice ſhoulde bee blinded rather turned vpſide downe let v marke muſt thinke wee haue gayned thing ſcaping hand men kyndle fyre god wrath vpon v bycauſe hath defaced iuſtice guiltie treaſon againſt god moreouer men abuſe themſelues thinke thing bee lawfull bycauſe ſhall bee puniſhed men hand therevpon take boldneſſe whereat god greeuouſly offended therfore curſe muſt needes increaſe kindle vpon v iob hath proteſted abuſed fatherleſſe done outrage weake hee addeth hee put trust golde ſayd vnto rich reſt ſelfe reioyced goodes increaſed vvee haue alwayes beare minde hath bin ſhewed heeretofore witte iob touched ſome one vertue alone comprehendeth generally whole rule good life god hath giuen v deede ynough v haue performed peece law leaſtwiſe wee able behoueth v indeuer rule frame life throughout according thynges god commaundeth like manner iob hath proteſted ſhewed himſelfe cruell towards fatherleſſe poore ſo ſayth hee puffed vp pride preſumption hymſelfe ſet ſtore himſelfe bycauſe hee rich surely ſingular vertue ſee cō monly man haue ſome little thing brag mē ſhall ſcarce beare fooliſh ouerweening vve need king prince puff ſelues vp vaunt ſelues ſoone man hath little goodes vppon tiptoe ſpreadeth hys wing vaingloriouſneſſe men alſo woman ſurely ſee ſoone womē haue wherewith flowe pompe exceede theyr degree againe man doth ſo chaunge countenance vouchſafeth looke vpon neighbor one ſide ſcarce open mouth ſhall ſo ſcornfully proudly men wyll afraid ſpeake thus ye ſee pride appeareth euery would come great heapes golde ſiluer thing iob ſheweth rich multiplied hard thing man ſhould alwayes ſo milde lowly hath coffer full gold ſiluer ſhould ſet nothing vvee ſee therefore god wrought marueylouſly iob ſuffered blinded vayne preſumption ſo rich cauſed poſſeſſe rich ſuch wiſe hee alwayes ready leaue ſet hart vpon looke iob proteſteth hymſelfe ſame commaunded v according ſee ſayd pſalme ryches increaſe ſet harte thereon ſay make idolles put youre truſt neyther bee puffed vp hautineſſe reſpect doth saint paule alſo ſay couetouſneſſe idolatrie vnpoſsible man ſhould couetous gather muche therewithall bee poſſeſſed pride would eſtimation reſpect hys goodes thys pride reigneth mē vndoubtedly double idolatrie one beare • h himſelfe hande god would fayle hee wherewith helpe himſelfe agayne bee riche hee deſpiſeth god thinketh himſelfe ſo well fenced hee needeth thing ſhort drunkenneſſe like man drunken maketh himſelfe beleeue wonder ſo man rich preſumeth vpon rich remembreth mortall man forgetteth himſelfe ſuch wiſe ſticketh aduaunce himſelf againſt god ſo let v marke iob proteſteth thing himſelfe god commaundeth faithfull ſhoulde ſet myndes vpon rich though flowe vnto secondly let v marke rare vertue among men therefore wee haue neede imploy whole indeuer thervnto ſeeing wee cannot reſtrayne oure ſelues without greate difficultie withoute bringing oure ſelues vtterly vnder foote therefore let v indeuer holde ſelues ſuche ſtay rich may carie v away blinde v ſo farre make v ſet heart mynde vpon let v marke intollerable vice man truſt goodes exceeding heynous offence man robbe god due honour gyue dead ſenſeleſſe creature doth hee make god rich ſayd afore whiche preſumeth ſo much vppon yee ſee god bereft honour golde ſiluer whiche dead creature haue monſtrous thing vvherefore let v learne cannot preſume ſelues vnder colour goodes god giueth v wee muſt become ranke traytors god foule idolater saint paule termeth couetous folke iob alſo ment expreſſe ſaying haue ſet heart vpon golde haue ſayd wedge golde thou art truſt heere iob bringeth talke betwene himſelfe money verely man talke vnto rich hee openeth cheſt coffer hee enter communication though hee ſome body talke maner ſpeeche iob doth well ſet foorth folly ouerweening riche men truſting rich haue ſecret conference conſpiracie golde ſiluer true ſpeake yet without ſpeaking ceaſſe haue thing iob ſheweth heere vvherefore often wee bee tempted put truſt creature earthly thing let v call minde robbing god honour purloyning giue thing nothing therefore let v abhorre ſuch dealing therewithall alſo let v remember condemnation iob layeth heere vpon v let v compare oure ſelues vvhat ſhame man ſhould aduaunce himſelfe gaze vpon fethers thinke himſelfe • oly fellow bycauſe hee woorth wote beholde iob poſſeſſed greate treaſures gathered golde ſiluer heapes yet notwithſtanding alwayes hild himſelfe ſuche lowlineſſe hee bin poore man vvhat ſhame v bee lifted vp little ſeeing iob blinded great aboundance god giuen hym marke one poynte furthermore let v marke great triall man riche yet notwithſtanding becommeth proud continueth alwayes milde without preſuming himſelfe walketh better another man yee ſee heere good triall therefore let v thinke haue atteyned great vertue come point man found citie geneua whole countrey lyke vnto iob truly man ſhould gather richeſt mē togither would ſay nothing compariſon iob poſſeſſed boaſt themſelues nowadayes rich ſhoulde thinke themſelues great men bycauſe mounted vppon blade onyon man ſhould compare theyr wealth iobs lord doth ſo hold mē ſo low ebbe let aſſure themſelues profite greater wealth would burſt would bee cauſe decay woulde mount ſo hie ſhoulde breake theyr necke let v marke lord procureth benefite welfare ſuffereth v mount ſo hie wee could weld good fortune terme ſee although wee haue occaſion aduaunce ourſelues oure ſtate bee ſimple may yet notwithſtanding alwayes deſirous grow great yea euen deſpite god nature thing thyngs lo heere thing ought make v beare eſtate better pacience euen though neuer ſo baſe ſmall yea let thē pooreſt ſort vnderſtand god intendeth humble ſubdue end ſhould bee giuen vntoo pride al likelyhood would bridle hold ſhort ſuch triall howſoeuer world go v let content v oure lorde knoweth meete v hath hande ſo cannot letted giue v knoweth good expedient v thus ye ſee wee haue marke effect concerning ſayde heere iob put truſt golde vaunted hymſelfe though ſaw riche yet well woorthy noted addeth wit bee reioyced hande coulde heape vp muche goodes came place reioyced behalfe ſhoulde ſeeme firſte bluſhe iob ſpake himſelfe poſsible bee found mortall man cannot man ſhould gladde hath goodes impoſsible ſhould block wood vvhat doth iob meene ſaying reioyced let v marke anſwer ſpeaketh heere manner gladneſſe naturall thing man ſadde poore glad rich gladneſſe euil ſelfe written thou ſhalt eate drinke mery lord thy god therefore lorde giue v goodes ſo haue cheriſhe oure ſelues end ſhould merrie haue told already ſo little doth mirth gladneſſe diſpleaſe god condemned ſelfe rather token faith feare whiche wee haue towardes ſomuch learne thereby praiſe goodneſſe yeeld thanks benefites dealeth vnto v iob ſpeaketh heere blind reioycing ſuch among worldling caried away goodes ſo forget god remember frailtie exalted themſelues frantike ioy inordinate ioy ioy turneth v away god maketh v ſo drunken know bee iob ment heere bee ſhort doth v vnderſtande hilde minde ſo bridled rich came indeede receyue god hande glad yeelding god thankes increaſing ſort yet notwithſtanding withall repoſe felicitie rich principall poynt haue note wherein men abuſe themſelues reſt vpon theſe tranſitorie thynges whereas ought bee led vvhen ſpeaking welfare felicitie men behoueth v tende vnto god aſſure oureſelues wee bee ſeparated hym wee bee vnhappie goodes pleaſures honour whiche wee poſſeſſe many condemnation vppon v thus ye ſee would behoue v ſeeke god riſeth queſtion concerning oure welfare happineſſe contrary part wee ſee men buſie head corruptible thing inſomuch make god thē one gold ſiluer another honour credite third pleaſures vvhen man deſireth rich behold marke ſhooteth hee ſetteth bee riche happie caſe meane letteth god alone giueth quite ouer man ſeeketh exalted dignitie credite ſo rauiſhed careth bee ſeparated god one whoremonger giuen wicked luſt beleeueth goeth well hee glad ſo may inioy deſire vve ſee whereas men ought tend trauell godwarde reſt themſelues vpon corruptible thing ſo let v marke heere iob reioyced rich goodneſſe god made rich yet could ſufficiētly vnderſtood declared familiarly word ouerdarke themſelues bycauſe wee woulde alwayes vſe ſome hypocriſie god though wilie ynough beguile men hope euer ſcape ſtartingholes doo halfe knowe themſelues therefore man ſay one worde wee muſte reioyce rich god giueth verieſt niggardes verieſt pinchpennyes worlde wyll alledge excuſe make proteſtation full mouth oh reioyce rich forſomuch god hath giuen glory onely guideth gouerneth lo men full hypocriſie ſeeke alſo ſome fayre colour verniſh filth withall therefore ſayd needefull expounde better ſentence reioycing god rich vvhat doth import hauing eye god hath giuen v goodes poſſeſſe ſhould vnderſtande therein meeneth ſhew himſelfe father towards v ſeing oure father good reaſon alſo wee ſhoulde bee chyldren oure ſydes towardes hym god child wee cannot bee wee muſte vſe brotherly loue towardes men bearing mynde goodes whyche wee haue layde pledge hande god releuing neighbour haue neede let v vnderſtande god wyll haue v tyed theſe earthly thing wee regarde god wee wyll immediately haue eye endleſſe life hee hath prepared v heauen ſhall wee bee wedded theſe corruptible thynges neyther ſhall wee make rich bee dirt myre wallowe oure ſelues suche giue theyr heartes ouer vntoo ryches quamyre men ſay heere like haue plucked oute one legge ſincke deeper ſo cannot get thoſe put theyr truſte worlde ſo farre vnable rayſe vp themſelues godwarde ſtagger ſtumble reele bee ſhorte cannot get oute gulfe wherein bee plunged contrary beholde heere oure lorde offereth himſelfe v calleth v heauenly lyfe hee ſhoulde ſay hye apace marche yee ouer worlde bee wedded therefore wee followe incouragement whiche god gyueth v certayne wee ſhall haue none deſire go forwarde heauenly lyfe wee ſhall bee hilde backe good worlde heerewithall alſo let v marke reioycing god except contented alone according ſayde ſixteenth pſalme lorde mine heritage portion longing nowe haue contentation certayne wee wyll paſſe worldely good whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god bring v therevnto ſobeeit wee poſſeſſe alone neuer taken away v vve heare alſo howe ſayde vntoo abraham thine exceeding greate rewarde ſaying god intendeth driue v vnto holde heartes mindes faſte ſettled without raunging heere wee ſee nowe reioyce god rich haue declared alreadie man reioyce god behoueth ſhewe well welth pouertie hearte wedded worldlye goodes wealth beeyng letted followe way god ſetteth afore diſcharge himſelfe dutie towardes neyghboures pouertie beeyng pacient ſhall pleaſe god bereeue good hee ſo cōmeth cōcluſion yet ſeparated god ynough fauour therefore nowe behooueth bee quyet hee thing whome ought take reſte effect whiche iob mente intendeth teache v example hee ſayeth hee reioyced rich alſo bee noted reioycing carryeth thankeſgyuing ſay wee haue wherewith reioyce god behooueth v alſo glorifie acknowledging wee haue thing meere goodneſſe furthermore pryde alſo condemned ſaying whereas bee forbidden reioyce rich ende ſhoulde v • unt ourſelues thinke ſelues better men th • sainct paule ſayeth timothee warne riche men worlde bee proude hyghe minded truſte lyuing god sainct paule ſheweth haue touched alreadie namely rare vertue ryfe bee founde riche man ſhould lowly haue pryde prayſe himſelf aboue yet al poſsible v reioyce god pryde muſt thruſt vnder foote hart wholy ouermayſtered foraſmuch men cannot attayn therevnto without greate hardneſſe greate ſtreyning themſelues aboue power sainct paule ſheweth cōuenient remedie truſt liuing god wiſt truſte god certaine rich ſhould carie v away muſte needes followe ſuche wedded rich know truſte god neyther paſſe grace according alſo haue ſayde alredy howe naughte paule place termeth couetouſneſſe idolatrie iob proteſted ſo addeth haue looked vp sunne ſhined moone walking • ir lyght haue layde hande vppon mouthe ſurelye beynouſe thing renouncing god aboue haue expounded ſentence though iob ſhould proteſt worſhipped sunne moone bycauſe olde time ſame common ſuperſtition ſpecially eaſt countreyes iob thoſe partes wee haue ſeene heeretofore ſo ſhoulde ſeeme iob mente declare heere hee done moſt men among whome liued ſay wondered gazed sunne moone attributed godly maieſtie vntoo made idol ſurely god telleth people expreſly moyſes muſte ſo blinde woorſhippe sunne moone sunne true hee hath woonderfull lyghte ſee ſome markes god glorie like cace moone alſo cauſe ſayde preache vnto v god ſpeaketh vntoo v theyr mouthe ende ſhoulde allured come vnto therewithall god ſayeth vnto woorſhippe sunne moone vnthankeful ende haue created faſhioned ende yee ſhoulde know mee euen mee creator yee contrarie vnthankefulneſſe doubled sunne ſeruant vvhat moone handemayde vvherefore doth sunne ſhine giue light make earth frutefull according god giueth vſe ſeeing creature howe noble ſoeuer ſubiect vnto v god hath ordeined thē v ſeruice foule vnthankfulneſſe v make idolles expoſition true yet agreeth preſent place iob ment vſe another ſimilitude purpoſe go forwarde matter haue treated alreadie namely hee preſumption pryde wee ſee howe proude ſorte caſte vp nozes winde ſay take themſelues bee common rate men make wote ſtately countenance though woulde ſeparate themſelues mortal life pryde extendeth onely neighboures alſo looke ſo loftie euery preace god ſuche ſtatelineſſe sunne moone thoughe bee farre aboue v notwithſtanding highe ynoughe ouerlooke ſaying wee nowe vvhiche v greater vvhich v higher iob ment expreſſe men fooliſhe hautineſſe aduauncing ſetting themſelues meaſure bee ſhorte voucheſafe holde themſelues common trayne woulde greater god graunteth bee thus yee ſee looke vp sunne hee ſhineth vnto moone ſhee walketh hir brightneſſe yet neuertheleſſe ſee lord giueth v token feebleneſſe wee cannot looke vppon sunne oure eye dimmed hande true god woulde haue v reioyce light sunne maketh walke skie v ſeruice vve ſee howe iourneyeth giue v light beſides wee knowe alſo sunne giueth liuelineſſe oure body wee ſee earth made frutefull warmth thence drawe ſubſtance nouriſhment yet therewithall lorde putteth v minde frayltie meeken v wee cannot looke vp oure eye ſhall bee dimmed thoſe whiche looke vp ſorte vnto ſhining sunne moone hir light woulde fayne ſhewe themſelues valiaunt fellowes ſpyte nature worlde beſide iob proteſteth hee none ſuche therewithall addeth alſo heart beguiled ſecrete ſo hande ſhoulde layde mouth vvhen hee ſayeth hee beguyled ſecrete heart ſerueth expreſſe better hee onely bene curteous lowly towards men alſo bene continually little one god notwithſtanding men prayſed although euery man reuerence ſo dreaded wholeworld yet glorified thoſe thing inſomuche anatomie beene made heart euer within bene ſounded gaged bottome man ſhoulde haue founde hautineſſe ſaying vſeth afterwarde hee ſayeth hee kiſſed hande hande came mouth bee kiſſed expound ſaying commended vertues make meritorious ſettle truſte welfare vpon goodneſſe holineſſe life doctrine good expoſition ſelfe notable vttered man liued corrupte tyme sainct gregorie men call lyued time ignorance corruption afterward biſhoppe rome declareth beaſtly wickedneſſe yea vtter renouncing god man truſte owne deſertes yet adayes cheefe article controuerſie betwixte v papiſtes ſay ſaluation grounded vpon free goodneſſe god vpon death paſsion lorde ieſus chriſte wee bee ſaued fayth onely contrariwiſe pope haue euery man owne ſauiour yet one pope rome neuertheleſſe cā skill ſay renouncing god outragious wickedneſſe mē kiſſe hand ſay truſt work make meritorious vertues doctrine good profitable yet notwithſtanding text muſte taken ſimplie concerne iobs vertues true comprehended howbeeit haue ſeene afore hee ſpeaketh generally occaſions men take truſt creature themſelues therfore ſayth mouth haue kiſſe • • ſay haue leaned mine owne credite thing elſe haue bene ſo beaſtly make idolles good honour worde kiſſe betokeneth homage honour mouth haue kiſſed hande ſay vayne ſelfe truſte homage honour ſelfe haue done ſo ſayeth let god curſe mee doubt renouncing liuing god souereyne god heere wee haue marke ſayde highmindedneſſe intollerable thing god manner ſpeache looking vp sunne iob vſeth bee marked well true naturally countenance looketh vpward god would ſhould difference betweene v brute beaſtes behalfe hee hath giuen beaſtes hanging lookes bycauſe looke downewarde grounde man hath countenance lift vpward bycauſe hee looketh better excellenter ſtate heauen deede intent ſhoulde alwayes looke vp alofte ſeeke god heauenlye kingdome meane let ſhoulde humble ſelues alſo cauſe dauid proteſteth hee meddled greate matter woonderfull thing highe manner ſpeaking partly like vnto ſimilitude iob vſeth dauid ſayeth lord thou knoweſt haue walked greate thing ſo lawfull men deale greate matter ſtate iuſtice honorable carrying aboute god woorde greate thing alſo bee ſhorte man findeth ſome let vocation man inſtructe others hee take vppon teache child ſchoole eyther bothe creature faſhioned image god ought refourme greate matter man haue whole countrey guyde excellent matter yes dauid ſpeaketh puffing vp hearte woulde aduaunce ſelues know deale matter great weyght▪ therefore hee addeth woonderfull thing aboue ſay deſire deale thing paſſed capacitie iob ſayeth looked vp sunne ſay caſt vp noze playe royſter aduaunce ſelfe agaynſte god tyme reputation worlde heereby wee ſee touched afore fooliſhe luſte men make themſelues eſteemed intollerable thing god vvhat bee done behooueth v come remedie whiche lowlineſſe seeyng god forbiddeth v lift vp countenance high let v caſt downe owne good wee haue ſufficient cauſe ſo wee looked well vpon ſelues woulde continually practize prouerbe namely hee knoweth himſelfe beſte ſet leaſte ſtore himſelfe foraſmuche lothe knowe ourſelues ſtate wonder though ſo caried away fooliſhe pryde coulde finde heartes ſtie aboue clowdes vvherefore lette v marke ſtandeth v hande examine well owne wantes ende wee may bee reſtreyned modeſtie able proteſt wee haue caſt vp heades haue alwayes looked downward acknowledging haue whereof make boaſte marke one poynte secondly ſayde iobs hearte led away couert lette v beare minde humilitie lowlineſſe conſiſteth outward apparāce towards mē ſhal ſee many whiche meeke gentle outwarde likelihoode yet meane whyle ceaſſe foſter fooliſhe ſelfeweening heartes haue eſtimation themſelues vvee ſee howe theſe hypocrite outwardly framed vnto lowlineſſe notwithſtanding inwardely ſo proude ready bruſte poyſon agaynſte god thing humble outwardly amongſt men ſeeme ſimple ſheepe meane whyle play buls iniuſtling againſte god example ſuch glorie theyr owne vertues thinke earne paradiſe religious rabble popedome doo certaynely lifte vp themſelues agaynſt god inſomuche make account theyr owne merites muche woorſe pretende ſtatelyneſſe towardes men bee man puffed vp vayne pryde ſetteth oute himſelfe brauerie thinketh grounde beareth euerye man mocke ſtinking folly cānot borne withall nowe ſuche preſumption ſette ſelfe againſt god althoughe bee hidden inwardely pray muche villeynous lette v marke well ynough v beare ſweete amiable countenaunce pretende milde behauiour towardes men wee muſte looke heart led away ſecrete wee haue pryde hydden within althoughe appeare men yet ſhall fayle bee condemned god therewithall lette v marke couert pryde condemned ſhall ſcape whiche ſpreade wing vaunte themſelues openly lette v vnderſtande lorde ſetteth vpon scaffolde ende wee ſhoulde knowe vice wherevntoo wee inclined whiche reygneth v tyll god correct furthermore touching kiſsing handes haue tolde alreadie manner ſpeeche importeth dooing homage honor without cauſe holy ghoſt hath vſed ſuch ſpeeche thing wherein men falſely beguyle themſelues taking vppon honor belongeth vnto god plaine ſpyting sainct paule declareth therefore concluded vntill ſuch time men vtterly diſtruſte themſelues miſlike theyr owne vertues ſhall neuer bee throughly humbled ought neyther ſhall honour god becommeth deſerueth nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue heeretofore done ſeeing ſo miſerable may throughly conſider owne wantes learne ſhake pryde foraſmuch lord ſheweth v ſo often welfare felicitie glory conſiſt wee may learne ſeeke ſo mortifie al fleſhly luſtes ieſus chriſt may reygne peaceably vnto whome ſouerayne dominion giuen intent knee ſhould bow inaſmuch behooueth v paſſe world thing may holde v backe conuenient neceſsities lyfe hee ſuffer v bee ſtill intangled wee may trauayle towarde heauenlye kingdome ſo vſe creature hath ordeined vſe wee may make idolles wee may nother thorough miſgouernment thorough outrage wedded worlde ſo paſſe thorough wee may alwayes ſtill go forwarde bee gathered vp euerlaſting reſte purchaſed v lorde ieſus chriſt may pleaſe hin graunte grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe c cxvj sermon ſixt vpon xxxj chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon 26 27 28 verſes vpon text added heere 29 reioyced aduerſitie mine enemie vvere glad vvhen euill befell 30 haue ſuffered mouth ſpeake euill vtter curſes agaynſt 31 houſhold folke haue ſayde vvho ſhall gyue v fleſh eate vve ſatisfied 32 ſtraunger lodge ſtreate gate vvere open trauayled vvay haue begonne already expounde ſentence iob proteſteth hee looked vp sunne moone effect ſaying hee declareth thereby hee puffed vp pryde thoſe whiche preſume vpon themſelues thinke great value truſting either rich credite thervpon deſpiſing men yea thinking themſelues bee ſubiect vnto god iob proteſteth puffed vp ſuche pryde chalenge worthineſſe himſelfe addeth renouncing god hyghe hee ſayde afore heynous offence woorthie death heere wee ſee howe god abhorreth highmindedneſſe men woulde aduaunce themſelues aboue meaſure thereof wee may gather lowlineſſe ſacrifize moſte acceptable others alſo oure owne nature wee doo eaſily abace oure ſelues behalfe behooueth man bee broughte nothing hee may eſteeme himſelfe hee intende bee taken reputed humble god humilitie lowlineſſe imbacing oure ſelues wee haue wherewith magnifie ſelues acknowledging nothing wretchedneſſe v wee woulde open oure mouth alledge thing ourſelues wee ſhal finde nothing vtter confuſion v ſo hearte conceyue vaine preſumptiō ſame winde may well bruſt v neuer feede v thus yee ſee true right humilitie lowlineſſe importeth namely man ſhould eſteeme himſelfe according alſo truthe wee haue reaſon ſo doo whoſoeuer ſetteth himſelfe muſte needes bee ouer blinde brutiſhe hee entreth intoo himſelfe examineth vertues thoroughly ſhall finde hee hath none god meere grace hee bounde vntoo yea vertues god giueth v matched many infirmity ſo wee cannot caſte downe eye therfore thoſe flatter themſelues nowadaies thorough ouerweening onelye beguyle themſelues alſo robbe god honour meanes become ranke traytours moreouer vtterly renounce liuing god ſayde truely righte harde firſte ſighte howbeeit well conſidered eaſie iudge iob exceedeth meaſure reaſon ſaying hee whiche flattereth himſelfe renounceth god vvhy ſo ynough confeſſe one god behooueth v alſo knowe hee reſerue due honour belongeth vntoo bereeue god parte glorie decke ſelfe withall ſhall wretched woorme earthe rotten carrion ſette ſo muche himſelfe god ſhoulde bee abaced intente hee ſhoulde bee exalted mingling heauen earth toogither peruerting whole order nature agayne god ſo robbed glorie put ſpoyle renouncing menne acknowledge bee ſuche one rather vtterly diſclayme therefore lette v marke well impoſsible men aduaunce preferre themſelues muſte needes bee kinde renouncing god heere yee ſee alſo ſayde pſalme wee haue ſong proude whiche ſtande vppon owne vertue ſtrengthe truſting therevntoo challenging ſo muche themſelues thinke harme may touche doo conclude hearte god vttermoſte theyr power reiecte religion true ſpeake mouthe yet ſo deede holye ghoſte whiche ſearcheth oure priuities declareth ſo therefore lette v learne honour god put away falſe imagination pryde maye bee beaten downe v impoſsible man ſhoulde offer ſeruice vntoo god withoute humilitie haue ſayde wee bee humble excepte wee acknowledge oure ſelues bee nothing nothing woorth glory ought reſerued vndiminiſhed vntoo god furthermore lette men eſteeme muche themſelues liſte yet ſhall feele god agaynſte mortall enemie vtter confuſion hee exalteth himſelfe ruſheth agaynſte god hee humbleth himſelfe leaneth vnder hande wee knowe oure owne wretchedneſſe wyll beate v downe god reache v hande lifte v vp ſette v lappe wee needes go aboute truſte oure owne ſtrength bee harde incounter v whiche ſhall ſerue breake oure heades bee wee neuer ſo proude god muſte ſhewe himſelfe oure aduerſary ſuche preſumptuouſneſſe v yee ſee haue remember ſtreyne lette v marke looking vp sunne moone ſaye mennes loftineſſe preſuming vpon themſelues may twoo ſortes one vnder coloure theyr rich ſome honour wherein bee placed forget themſelues thinke bee mortall creature vvhen come point god may wel puniſh ſuche blinde pryde according fonde thing woorthie bee ſcorned whole worlde lyfe appurtenaunces manner pryde whiche men ſo flatter themſelues thinke haue bothe wiſedome power gouerne themſelues deſerue much godward men preſume ſo farre themſelues chalenge prayſe theyr owne ſaluation muſte needes ſtumble deadly fall bycauſe principal poynt god reſerueth himſelfe ſhould know ſelues ſtate damnation vtterly forlorne paſt recouerie ſhould recouer hope free goodneſſe vvhen doctrine defaced aſmuch exalt men ende god ſhoulde bee brought nought one men would put god honor ſpoyle vvherfore lette v learne caſte downe oure heades aſſuring ſelues coulde glory god alone beaten downe ſelues hauing corrected fooliſh ſelf weening wherewith wee puffed vp god woulde releeue v make v partaker glory might beleeue goodes hath doo belong vnto v haue wee nothing ſide god rich ynough ſupply wāts may aſſure ſelues hee fayle v thing according scripture ſayeth although men poore wretched ſo nothing wherof may boaſte yet notwithſtanding god glorye wil couer al vnclenneſſe ſo ſhal aſhamed go cheeke cheeke angel heauē god child member lorde ieſus chriſte thus much concerning humilitie lowlineſſe ſpake iob hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth proteſtation whiche hee reioyced inconuenience happened enimies gladde hee ſaw thē fall giuen mouth leaue cast foor • h curſes vpon yea ſo perſiſted minde hee giuen eare houſholde ſeruauntes prouoke reuenge neuertheleſſe reſtreyne himſelfe notwithſtāding came firebrand moue therevntoo yee ſee proteſtation iobs contayneth witte although men beare ill indeuered hurt put loſſe yet notwithſtanding rendred like like whiche nouriſhed ſecrete hatred hearte proteſtation well woorthie noted bycauſe one hardeſt thing god commaundeth v cauſe hypocrite papacie haue bene aſhamed falſifie holye scripture ſaying lorde ieſus chriſtes willing v loue enimies counſell commaundemēt vvhat moued vſe ſuch blaſphemy bycauſe meaſured god cōmaundements ſtrength eye man abilitie ſaw thing ſurmount power concluded god cōmaund ſeeming god requireth nothing v whiche wee able performe verely ouerſhot themſelues far poynt theyr hypocriſie groſſe let v examine reſt god commaundements ſee whether fulfill ſhall find cannot haue ſo much one good thought beginne withall much leſſe bee able ſtirre one finger thē apply al ſtrength theſe hypocrite abuſe themſelues falſe imagination man able performe lawe god diuell ſo beſotteth thervpon ſurmize impoſsible men loue enimies therefore ſhake god yoke ſay expreſſe commaundement ought obſerued neceſsitie counſell ieſus chriſt giueth furthermore ſayd counſell cōcerneth perfectiō goſpell ſo vnder lawe blaſphemie ye ſee iob proteſteth know whither liued law moyſes publiſhed howbeeit haue ſhewed heeretofore hee afore time prophet make mention man offormer time yet neuertheleſſe declareth loued enimies whence came vnto came law whiche hath euer bene written heart faythful hath god ſet downe thing two table hath alwayes written holy ſpirit hart childrē el doth day whole holy ſcripture ſet thoſe thing eye graueth v holy ſpirit inſomuche cōformitie betweene doctrine preached inwarde grace god giueth v holy ſpirite agree poynts reſpects ſee lord ieſus chriſt came downe world iob proteſted loued enimies ſuch wiſe reioyced fal told behoued v marke well poynt ſhame ſhal v admoniſhed lord ieſus chriſtes exhortation go ſeeke ſtartingholes follow leaſtwiſe thoſe liued ſuch time doctrine yet darke▪ ſhall double faultie yes ſurely ſhall wee ſo let v marke firſt hath alwayes bin god wil louing enimies ſhoulde bee marke child proofe heereof let v harken ſayde lawe moyſes thine enimies oxe aſſe fallē ditch thou ſhalt lift god cōmaūdeth v good enimies brute beaſts ſhall beſt cā ſuccour owne perſons bound procure mine enemy welfare ſhew euē cattell ſhall perſon muche precious haue conclude agaynſt horrible blaſphemie papiſts god wil hath time bin faithful ſhould loue thoſe hate indeuer doo thoſe good whiche hurte marke one poynt heerevpon wee haue alſo marke counſell may freely bee left vndone ſtreyght cōmaundement againſt wee cannot ſtriue without offending god deadly nowe ſeing ſo god woulde binde faithfull loue enimies euen time lawe muche reaſon ſhould haue ſayde rule nowe haue large declaratiō holy mouth lord ieſus chriſt doctrine law darke ſelfe yea wreſted awry scribe phariſeys nowe hath ieſus chriſte brought againe pureneſſe told v loue thoſe hate v indeuer helpe thoſe would hurt v ſhall acknowledged god childrē surely horrible threate wee ſhall bee diſherited god kingdome wil ſhake v banniſhe v fellowſhip child seeyng lorde ieſus chriſte hath ſuche threatening tolde v muſt beare good enimies let v learne frame ſelues doctrine therin acknowledge ſhameleſſe boldeneſſe papiſts hath bene villeynous yea diueliſhe ſaying ieſus chriſtes woordes ſimple admonition ſeeing matched ſuch ſentence damnation god wyll renounce v baniſhe v oute kingdome wee ouermaſter heartes ſo farre loue thoſe hate v moreouer wee haue alſo mirror heereof lorde ieſus chriſt offered himſelfe ſuche deadly enimies vvherefore indured hee ſo bytter death reconcyle v nowe behooued reconciliation bee made hatred god oddes behold lorde ieſus chriſte yeelded himſelfe death yea curſes recouer v vntoo god father ſuche tyme wee enemy ought ſuch pledge breake heart though harder ſtone alſo wherevntoo sainct paule bringeth v backe epiſtle epheſians goeth ſubdue hatred wee haue cōceyued agaynſt enimies thus order whiche haue note thoſe whiche liued vnder lawe offended god intended reuenge themſelues therfore ſhall become v haue ſuch declaration haue told already howbeit ynough v beare enimies euill muſt alſo haue minde ſeeke benefite welfare well woorthie bee noted diuers haue thōght ſhould diſcharged god ſo ranne naked ſworde agaynſt thoſe haue offended done wrong mee ſay ſeeke reuenge pray god auenge mee would mee good heart might ſee miſchiefe light vpon yea nay another manner practiſing doctrine ieſus chriſt declareth vnto v muſte pray curſe v ſpeake well backbite v good ſeeke hurt v contrariwiſe wee ſo full poyſon deſire nothing god ſhoulde ouerwhelme ſide ſoeuer miſhap befalleth glad done without ouerthrow conteyned doctrine lorde ieſus chriſt others alſo found haue ſo malicious heart ſuffer wicked luſtes haue open libertie wyll ſay mee ready forgiue wiſhe harme ſelfe yet meane ſeaſon cannot wiſh welfare profite ſuch haue diſpleaſed whome bee offended let v marke ynough v abſteyne reuenging handes tongue nother ynough v put away euill ſo wee would wiſh harme aduerſitie ſuch enimies behooueth v go one degree muſte loue iob loued enimies ſurely would haue reioyced miſfortune lette v learne onely keepe heart locked vp bee prouoked agaynſt ſuch offend v let v learne beare thē ſuch affection freendſhip may ſorie euill happeneth vntoo alſo haue pitie cōpaſsion ſeeme hard v iob man ſubiect affection wee bee yet god get vpper hande behooueth v fight cannot done without great inforcemente true wee muſte force oure ſelues howbeeit vpon truſte owne ſtrength praying vnto god giue v ſpirite meekeneſſe bring v thither wee ſee woorde leadeth v vvhat done looke vnto thing commaunded certayne nature draweth quyte backwarde ſhall angry man hurteth mee hath practized euill agaynſte mee although loue vprightneſſe good dealing yet ſhall fayle bee inflamed harteburning haue ſome deſire reuenge againſt ſuch haue gone harme yet notwithſtanding ſee heere ieſus chriſt condēneth mee pronounceth dreadful ſentence god ſhake mee ſhall razed number child loue mine enimies therfore ſeeing know onely infirmitie alſo frowardneſſe nature behoueth mee pray god correcte theſe vice mee knowe haue nothing bitterneſſe mee wel god hath ſpirite ſweeteneſſe therefore behoueth mee ſeeke hande go mee certayne frowardneſſe vexeth mee god hath ſpirite meekeneſſe gentleneſſe behoueth mee deſire make partaker wee haue recourſe ſort vnto god ſurely ſhall want thing furthermore lette v enter ſelues inforce ſelues ſhall wee gayne ſoothing ſelues true deede god commaundeth mee ſuche thing man feele mine owne infirmitie yea diſeaſed behold phiſition offereth himſeife commeth medicine hande yet leuer continue ſtill diſeaſe ſuffer medicine bee miniſtred vntoo mee nowe pray therefore bee excuſed vvherefore inaſmuch knowe vice v lette v go remedie wee neede ſeeke farre although wee loth yet behoueth v fight againſte luſtes aſſuring ſelues bee madde beaſtes therefore greate force violence muſte vſed oppreſſe heere yee ſee ſayde behoued v ſtreine inforce ſelues wee ſhall haue muche bring paſſe neuertheleſſe wee go ſorte god turne bitterneſſe nature louing kindneſſe ſweetneſſe wil ſuffer v hate enimies conſideration oft wee bee tempted hate enimies muſt cal minde requeſt wee make wee deſire god forgiue v oure fault forgiue offend v behooueth v cited god according deede come preſent ſelues god iudgement ſeate howe vvhen proteſte vnto god forgiue mine enimies deſire none pardon graunt yet meane nothing diſsimulation mee vvhat shall prayer bee turned intoo curſing wee thought well vppon ſurely wee myghte breake wicked ſtomacke v lengthe god ſhoulde haue victorie ſo ſhould eaſie v euen loue hate v wee maye better knowe euill v let v go degree scripture leadeth v poſsible wee ſhall bee ſtyrred vp man dooth v wrong vvell one ſinne already grudge agaynſt hearte according lorde ieſus chriſte ſayeth wee haue already gayned euerlaſting fire expreſſing hereof ſimilitude hee borroweth maner iudgements time therfore make compariſon three degree offending behalfe ſayeth firſte worthie puniſhed iudgemente wee open mouth vtter woordes ſpyte diſdayne agaynſte hath offended v condemnation yet grieuouſer feared condemned counſell cōſiſtorie ſomewhat ſolemnely aſſembled according ieſus chriſt alledgeth ſimilitude third degree whē come open raging woordes thorough choler offence deſerueth bee puniſhed chiefe court iuſtice ieſus chriſt leuing ſimilitude ſayth playnly ſuch one worthy hell fire meeneth three worthy yet notwithſtanding ſheweth degree euill man haue ſodaine choler although ſame ſettle hearte yet ye ſee hee hath already deſerued euerlaſting death god ſhall foſter deadly hatred heartes full venemous rancour reuenged haue done v wrong wherefore let v learne correcte vice v vnderſtande euill worde haue ſcaped mouth behoueth v ſorie fall sainct paule ſayth namely ſunne go downe vpon wrath leaſte ye giue poſſeſsion vnto sathan heereby warned haue bene moued diſpleaſure ſame muſt paſſe away ſunne muſt go downe vpon ſo anger ſhoulde multiplie ſelfe puniſhment sainct paule addeth ought touch v neere ſayth giue satan poſſeſsion v mā ſhould demaund v whether would diuell ſhould haue maſterie v reygne ouer v prince woulde vtterly abhorre yet notwithſtanding oft beare euill agaynſt enemy vve cannot make god lyer holie ſpirite ſpeaketh mouth paule wee knowe let v paſſe thinke thus oure ſelues yonder ſame creature god ſee hee wretched damned ſoule ought wee onely pray god ſuch way deſtruction agayne hath oure lorde ieſus chriſte redeemed mennes ſoules true effect death cōmeth whole worlde neuertheleſſe aſmuche v diſcerne betweene rightuous ſynners go deſtruction ieſus chriſte hath knowledge ſuffered death paſsion well v therefore behooueth v labour bring euery man ſaluation grace oure lorde ieſus chriſte may bee auayleable furthermore bee heauie v lette v conſider compariſon betweene god v hee offendeth god dayly yet neuertheleſſe aſſoone wee returne vnto hee giueth v libertie come familiarly thither without doubting wee ſhall receyued yet meane whyle man offende v meanes founde make v freendes agayne thus yee ſee haue gather ſentence heare iob proteſt hee onely forbare reuenge alſo ſory euill happened enemy hearte reioyced hee hearde ſpeaking neuertheleſſe holy scripture telleth v rightuous ſhall reioyce confuziō wicked true howbeit intent haue ſuch gladneſſe god alloweth behoueth v ſcoured clenſed priuy malice regarde oure owne perſons vvhen god child reioyce aduerſitie wicked muſt ende acknowledge god iuſt rightuous yet therwithall muſt alſo take warning walke feare ſeing god ſheweth himſelfe iudge giueth example inſtruction men coſte vvhen doo ſorte beholding vpright iuſtice god learning walke feare carefulneſſe example giueth v ſo haue reſpecte owne perſones reuenge ſelues prouoked wrath meanes euill done vnto v rather vtterly forgiue moreouer haue pitie compaſsion wretched ſoules periſh thus ye ſee maner wee may lawfully reioyce fall wicked true behoueth v glorifie god iudgements executeth worlde let v beware mingle fleſhly affection behooueth zeale pure wil reioyce aduerſitie god ſendeth vpon wicked furthermore iob addeth circumſtance haue touched ſay houſholde ſeruantes bene fyrebrandes prouoke woulde fayne haue reuenge himſelfe yet hee bene mooued whit hee ſayeth vnderſtande ſentence verie rudely though iobs ſeruaunts ſhould greeued entertayning ſtraungers courteouſely therfore wiſhed deade paynes wherevnto hee put quite matter iob meneth declare heere although ſeruauntes prouoked reuenge ſawe men doo harme wrong yet notwithſtanding hee refrayned himſelfe yeelded ſuche temptation well woorthy bee noted excellent vertue leſſe moued wrong done houſehold ſeruants man taketh owne wrōg ſo heart men cannot pacifie may perchaunce bee ſayd man hath diſpleaſure done ſtay ſelfe take wrong done owne perſone let alone reuenge well ynough yet cannot contente minde affection ſo farre order wee ſee contrariwiſe iobs ſeruauntes greeued men wrong maſter himſelfe therefore muſt needes ſayde ſpirite god wrought ſingular woonderfull faſhion howbeit muſte marke way hee dooth vaunte himſelfe heere purchace eſtimation ſette foorth mirrour patterne v god ſet vpon ſcaffolde ende wee ſhoulde laboure faſhion ſelues like vnto bee doubt excuſe v wee followe ſuche example vvhat done although haue temptation prouoke v reuenge ſelues oure enemy yea men alſo pricke v forwarde inflame v ſome alſo flatter v ſinnes yet muſte wee therfore beleue ſuch flattery muſt ſettle eies mindes vppon god cauſe men doo ſo eaſilye pardon iuſtifie themſelues god condemneth gyue eare ſuche come picke thankes tale bearing lawfull v specially haue doone wrong ſhould ſeeke reuenge requyte like like needeth retoricke perſuade v doo harme enemy vayne ſinewe v forward ynough way yea wee rather furious cace yet meane beholde aduocates come cloke oure vice ſoothing v vp oure ſinne much behooueth v minde diligently lord ieſus chriſt commaundeth v namely loue enemy ſuch wiſe eares ſtopped agaynſt thing may alleadged v men folke flatter v ſeeme maynteyners honour profite coulde finde heart imploy themſelues wholly v let v ſuſpect ſuch kind folke much better man ſhould rebuke v ſeeth v farre moued pacience ſhoulde labour aſſuage rage ſhould come ſet forward ſort notwithſtanding good according ſome men ſo affectioned towardes v ſee another doo v wrong come declare vnto v ſaying take ſuche harme bee myne owne reuenge ſuffer ſuche outrage done therfore may well come paſſe man ſhall haue ſome good zeale whē ſeeth v diſquieted meane ſhall gaine thruſt headlong greater ruine thē beſte freendes haue thoſe labour brydle v haue iniurie done v furthermore tempted ſuch makebates come increace miſcheefe let v recouer wittes vnto god ſay notwithſtanding men iuſtifie mee yet ſhall therefore quitte heauenly iudge therfore behoueth mee bridle ſelfe ſuffer wrong ſeeing pleaſeth god take mee one child becommeth mee follow faſhion ſelfe like vnto ſith cauſeth sunne ſhine vpon good euill muſt indeuer good ſuch would hurt mee meanes heape cole fyre vpon heades manner muſt practize ſentence morouer let v mark alſo iob addeth ſhall ſerue v ende namely ſtraunger lodged ſtreates gate alwayes open heere iob declareth freendly ſuch meane recompence alſo effect whereby wee ſhew haue right charitie towards men good ſuch able requite ſuch allied vnto v eyther kinred ſome bonde true perfect proofe charitie true freendlineſſe good ruled according godlineſſe yet poſsible ſo ſhall haue regard ourſelues otherwiſe like oftentimes ſee man ſeeketh owne peculiar profite dooing good kinſfolke frends wee doo good ſuche able requite yea ſuch vnknowen v therein ſhew ſerue god holde right rule charitie thus ye ſee iob proteſteth heere ſpecially hee ſpeaketh ſtrangers thoſe whome god commendeth vnto v thorough holy scripture without cauſe ſuch home owne country ſhall haue reliefe ynough ſhall haue kinred many helpes ſuccours man cannot lightly hurte cōtrariwiſe poore ſtrangers deſtitute al help haue nother frends kinſfolke nother haue ayde fauor towards world ye ſee thē right triall louing kindneſſe intend ſhewe wee ſerue god truely without ſeeking owne peculiar profite ſurely lord doth rigorouſly condemne outrage done ſtrangers thā thoſe done man owne neyghbours true twayne worthy cō demned nothing ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed howbeit let v marke therewithall god receiueth thoſe protection ſafe keeping mainteyned men verely ſee howe god ſheweth wee ſet ourſelues agaynſt mortall man wrong violence ſuche hee hath taken cuſtodie offending maieſtie ſo muche better ought thing bee printed heart ſo much ſee heathen men doo ſhame v behalfe intended ſhew ſome man ſlauiſhe wicked nature wont ſay auaunt thou art churle towards ſtrangers called mā whoremaiſter theefe drunkarde periured murtherer vvhen ſayde go thou art enemie ſtrangers much ſay thou art worſe brute beaſt paynim ſpake manner made common prouerbe ſhall become v profeſſe ourſelues god child wee fight ſo directly agaynſte order nature token mocke god full wold ſpitefully prouoke maieſtie agaynſte v therefore let v marke well proteſtation iob maketh witte hee onely liberall towardes thoſe whome knew bee abilitie requite alſo imployed himſelf vpon ſuch able make recompence let v conſider iob ſay god hath ſet one common general bonde among mankind behoueth v beſtow charitie vpon ſuche reſemble v haue pitie vpon ſuccouring euery v according▪ abilitie god child let v labour exerciſe true brother lineſſe towards men ſpecially towards thoſe neerely knit vnto v bond ſayth let v bend ourſelues aboue good nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v ſo feele wee may bee ſorie vice haue reygned ouermuche v yet ſtill reygne wee may flee refuge mercie therwithall may pleaſe tame mortifie wicked affection beare infirmity guyding v himſelfe drawing v neerer neerer vnto vntyll wee come ende race wherevnto wee trauell tyme life ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe according truth worthie lifte vp eye heauen c cxvij sermon ſeuenth vpon xxxj chapter 33 haue hid ſinne euery man doth put mine iniquitie ſecret 34 though vvere able breake great throng yet deſpized houſes aſtoniſhed kept ſilence vvent doore wee haue proteſtation well worthie noted iob ſheweth v owne example wee haue done amiſſe remedie hyde fault common cuſtome men do▪ confeſſe miſdeed willingly aſhamed acknowne ſinne haue cōmitted end may wiped god surely verie rare vertue therfore ſo much ſtandeth v hande marke ſhewed v iob ſpeaketh himſelfe onely giueth inſtruction may ſerue v therefore declareth hid ſinne layde vp ſecrete ſay laboured cleere himſelfe afore men yeelded hymſelfe guiltie acknowledged offence marke one poynt therewithall ſheweth men attainted vice hypocriſie faſhiō denie thing vſe ſtartingholes ſo fault put vnder foote place hath vſed worde adam ſignifieth man ſometimes taken euery man text iob ment ſay ſhall neuer bee founde ſo well touched acknowledge fault rather finde vayne backſhrinkings hide although vice doe raigne world yet doth iob proteſt hee cleare true adam began firſt trade ſhewed ſame ſuch came race ſee conuicted ſtreightwayes laboured hide himſelfe leaues afterwarde god ſummoned appeare ſtill found trifling excuſe woulde fayne haue ſcaped ſome meanes ye ſee adam firſt beginner ſhew hypocriſie poſteritie hee learned leſſon onely himſelfe alſo wrappe men two three v onely v haue nature surely diuell winneth much handes hee maketh v cloake faultes wee acknowledge wee muſt needes bee aſhamed wee haue couered euill wee thinke ſafe therevpon take leaue fall ſleepe euerie v findeth himſelfe experience pray prouoked mourne god craue pardon ſhould haue remorſe ſinnes bee ſorie ſeeke remedie yes deuill blindeth v elſe tieth kerchers eye elſe diſguyſeth thing ſuch wiſe vnto v wee cannot diſcerne euill lo caſe wee bee therefore behoueth v ſo much ſtudie leſſon putting vp wickedneſſe intoo boſome ſay hyde lay open true man knoweth ſinne poſsible hee ſhall become deſperate happened cain iudas neuertheleſſe cannot come repentance deſire forgiueneſſe god hand finally deliuered offence vntill layd open hypocriſie ſet aſide furthermore come knowledge ſinne defiance himſelfe deſire hyde himſelfe worldward according ſee haue alwayes vntruthes mouth iuſtifie ſelues withal ſuch thing v repentance bringeth true humilitie therefore conuicted god haue done amiſſe willingly acknowledgeth fault ſhrinking backe doubt alſo readie condemne offence men ſhew ſorie let v nowe ſee thing iobs time increaſed nowe adayes ſo muche nothing rife hypocriſie truely ſee text new thing men ſeeke diſguiſe themſelues take couert haue done amiſſe hath bene ſo time ſayd afore began adam hath continued vnto day howbeit ſee ſuch ſhameleſneſſe worlde preſent thoſe dayes nothing compariſon theſe ſee one go warne man ſinne hee ſhall finde braſen face denie thing altogither manifeſt partie ſhal know wel ynough euill knowne yet notwithſtanding haue ſpoken would ſtoppe euery man mouth outfacing yea many time contenteth himſelfe ſuch ſhamefull deniall alſo falleth quarelling threatning ſpeake men hide fault iobs time doo much theſe dayes▪ yet ſufficient defence nother ſhall receyued god according wee ſee text although men hardharted wilful ſo man come reaſon folke labour drawe ſinners repentaunce kicke agaynſt lyke reſtie iades lette v aſſure ſelues iobs example ſet forth learning wee muſt followe common trade ſay euery man doth ſo common cuſtome let v looke vpon god draweth v contrarie way vvould men iuſtifie mee god haue euery v condemne himſelf▪ men conceal fault end might vnknowne god haue v diſcouer yea euen lowlineſſe behoueth v come poynt ſay ſee men doo ſo euery man cuſtome vvhat though men ſo time iob condemned holy ghoſt therefore wee ſee men like adayes ſay noman confeſſeth faultes yet neuertheleſſe let faythfull learne frame themſelues whiche ſhewed wit onely mourne god alſo ſhewe menne bee ſorie theyr harte condemne themſelues ſuch wiſe may become iudges obteyne mercie heauenly iudge returning vnto ſhort ſee hypocriſie condemned text beſt v abſteyne vtterly ſinne keepe ſelues foraſmuch wee bee ſo frayle wee cannot liue worlde without taking manye falles remedie ſtoupe mourne god moreouer go aboute ſaue honeſtie ſuch wiſe afore men wee ſhoulde yeeld ſelues guiltie often need ſhall requyre true god commaundeth man proclayme ſtreetes hath done amiſſe ſay haue committed ſuch fault rather caſt ſtumbling block yet ſtandeth v vpon mark ſayde holy ſcripture namely firſt al muſt lowly towards neighbour aſſuring ſelues wee bee infected many vice vvhat cauſe man deſpyſeth al men beare nothing hand thundereth haue done amiſſe vvhat cauſe ſay hypocriſie wee knewe owne infirmity ſurely would brydle v wee ſhould condemne folkes auenture begin ſelues thus yee ſee firſt thing haue commaūded v holy scripture wee milde gentle bearing one another kinde confeſsing owne ſinnes ſecond thing wee haue offended man behoueth v come reaſon wee ſee otherwiſe haue acceſſe vnto god according alſo lorde ieſus chriſt ſheweth v sacrifice offering ſhall accepted vnleſſe reconciled neighbour haue offended therfore muſt learne ſorie behalf knowe ſinnes thirdly haue giuen cauſe ſtumbling let v come humbly amende yea ſo amend euil may borne withall kick agaynſt ſpurre thus ye ſee three confeſsions ſcripture requireth v reſpect men herewithall let v marke commeth proceedeth ſayd right meening haue ſorowing god vntill fully ſory hart haue offended ſhall neuer make pure right confeſsion men whatſoeuer wee doo ſhall bee feynedneſſe ſo certaine thoſe whiche ſhall haue confeſſed themſelues god ſuch alſo haue modeſtie iuſtifying themſelues afore men mockerie man ſhall ſay oh know ſelf ſinner god yet notwithſtanding ſhall bee ſo wilfull towards men reaſon truth wrung one ſheweth diuell hath bewitched hydeth fault layeth thē vp boſome much hee poſsibly vvherefore let v marke well wee bee come poynt feeling ſinnes beeing aſhamed haue tranſgreſſed god lawe haue done againſt rightuouſneſſe wee ſhall haue pride hinder v making pure confeſsion ſuch wee ought make furthermore behoueth v alſo marke howe ſayd iob put ſinne ſecret importeth verie much men cannot beguile god beguile themſelues therevpon ſeemeth haue gayned muche put ſinnes theyr mynde thinke vpon man forget himſelfe caſt fault behinde backe thruſt vnder foote without thinking vpon hee ſad feeleth greefe ſotted wickedneſſe ſtarke rotten feeleth yet meane whyle god ceaſſeth doo dutie iudge thing regiſtred althoughe hee make countenaunce tyme yet muſt come accompt men coulde finde theyr harte bee alwayes hidden ſay ſee faultes thinke ſhall neuer come light ſin continueth ſtill although bee buried reſpect men yet wil god bring light iob ſheweth heere men beguile themſelues couering ſinnes ſort muſte needes appeare brought light howſoeuer world go let v remember beſt v vncloke owne fault god may deliuer v bring free hart cōdemne euill thē certaine ſhal vtterly away require therfore let v condemne euill find end cō demned god long wee holde hart ſo cloſe labour conceale fault thē behoueth god fight againſt v v feele belongeth ſcatter clowdes plucke away figleaues wherwith ſhal haue couered diſhoneſty inſomuch ſhal inforced perceiue ſpite teeth ſhal knowne mē angel haue remember ſtreyn mētion made putting man ſin ſecret ſhort wil happē vnto thē doth vnto thoſe hide ſore ſore hidden body yet mean meane made purge man couereth ſuch wiſe ſhall knowne yet infection doubleth cloking rancor increaſeth want clenſing better opened ſhould haue ſome iſſue purge ſelf thing cannot bicauſe diſeaſe ſo pent vp within euen ſo fare wee go hide fault rottē ſore wee would faine hold force ſtryuing kepe ſecrete breedeth greater rankling cauſeth miſchiefe increaſe inflame vvhat done meanes haue ſpoken come god aſhamed cōfeſſe wretchedneſſe end may remedie knoweth moſt cōuenient v alſo become owne iudges hee ſo gracious vnto v make v owne iudges inſtead condemning v readie acquite v contrarypart drag backe much offend god prouoke greater vengeance againſt v cauſe v ſhet vp fault ſecrete woont mention made expreſſely hydings clokings couerts bicauſe men nature find many prety ſhifts ſleightes ſhun god preſence yea true may wel ſhrink aſide yet doth god ſee v throughly neuertheleſſe prophete eſay ſayth wicked dig themſelues caues think vpon god iudgement ſeemeth thē haue verie well ſhifted matter ſerue turne fal flat contrary runne vp find new mouſehole cranie ſafe ſo beare themſelues hand cannot hyde themſelues altogyther play partriches yong childrē think ynough owne eye hidden ſo cauſe expreſſe mention made hydings naturally giuen hypocriſie ſeeke continually ſome prety ſleights beguile god wherein beguile ſelues ſeene doth foade v wickedneſſe meane cōſider ſo diuill doeth ſo poſſeſſe v wee cānot recouer ſelues vnto ſouerain phiſition able heale cure al diſeaſes furthermore iob hath proteſted knowing fault addeth although bin able breake greate throng yet hee feared verieſt raſcolles went houſe hrwbeeit paſſe let v marke maner man ſpeaketh iob lyued angell amongs men behaued himſelfe ſo vncorruptly like hardly bee ſeene whole worlde yet notwithſtanding ſayth • e hid fault ſhall man compare rightuouſeſt perfecteſt men iob hee ſhall finde come nothing neere holineſſe vprightneſſe man ſuch feare god liued ſo vncorrupt life acknowledged himſelfe ſinner would ſtand mayntenance honour yeelded himſelfe guiltie hee done amiſſe ſhame day ſuch great deale ſuch holyneſſe confeſſe theyr faultes playnely throughly pray muſte worlde beeneedes worſe blinde nowe adayes men cannot bee made yeeld glorie vnto god confeſsing ſinnes iob hath declared vnto v eye vnto blinde feete lame father fatherleſſe defender wydowes againe declareth hee common hoſt poore ſtraungers hee clothed naked wooll ſheepe hee eaten bread alone done man violence although credite place iuſtice might haue beene borne yet neuer giuen man cauſe complayne declaration theſe thing hee addeth hee hidden fault adayes none v hee infected many vice whereof iob cleere yet notwithſtanding woulde ſeeme much rightuous hee muſte diuell needes haue plucked eye ſo ſee ſinne haue forgone remorſe extremitie vttermoſt poynt euill saint paule ſayeth let v learne compare iob ſelues oft wee bee ſo fooliſh ouerweening acquite ſelues let v acknowledge wee come farre ſhort ſuch perfection iob therefore nothing v mourne god condemne ſelues vtterly wee ſo condemned let v learne vſe ſuche mildeneſſe towardes men wee haue offended neighbour amiſſe may amend haue done man wrong may labor recōciled ſhort may aſhamed ſinnes poyntes reſpects yeelde glory vnto god iob proceedeth mildneſſe ſaying hee feared veryest raſcat • e men notwithſtanding able breake beare greas throng people text taken otherwiſe ſome men hebrew worde iob vſeth▪ heere meane word haue tranſlated breake burſt aſunder ſignifieth ſometime feare afrayde ſayde worde ſignifieth feare bee afrayde alſo oppreſſe beare trample treade vnder foote breake brooſe burſt aſunder therefore expounde though iob declared feared great multitude ſay neuer abaſhed rebuke euill whereſoeuer ſawe according wee bee zealous godward certaine ſuffer man offend without ſetting ſelues agaynſt ſeeing god hath done v honour make v aduocates cannot leaſtwiſe declare miſliking euill indeuer ſtoppe much may bee poſsible putting leſſon vre sainct paule ſheweth v ſaying muſt haue felowſhip frutes darkeneſſe muſt reproue many therefore expound text though iob proteſted hee ſet hi mſelfe agaynſt euill letted meanes whereſoeuer hee founde although might haue purchaſed himſelfe diſpleaſure hatred whole worlde yet notwithſtanding ceaſſed condemne euill alwayes hee founde doctrine good profitable ſurely wee ſee howe neceſſarie thing ſtabliſh ſelues ſuch ſtedfaſtneſſe wee intende ſtoppe euill wee muſt haue whole worlde ſay moſt men enimies true god commaundeth v ſeeke peace men neere wee dutie behalfe ſhall ſure ſet whole worlde toppes go rebuke ſinne wee ſee howe euery man flattereth himſelfe correction ſo harde bitter ſpecially adayes man able ſuffer ſeeing ſo need ſettle ſelues ſuch ſtoutneſſe although whole worlde ſhould riſe vp agaynſt v men without exception ſhould labour oppreſſe v yet wee ſhoulde ſwarue aſide perſiſt euen condemne euill doctrine ſurely good profitable conſider order text wee ſhall finde naturall ſenſe bee haue touched firſt worde iob vſeth ſignifieth for▪ albeit although thinke proteſtation iob ment denie ſtoode feare neuer ſo great multitude verbe commeth firſt woorde ſayde ſignifieth feare howbecit commoneſt ſignification firſt word ſame ſpake albeeit although therevnto verbe doth commonly ſignifie breake ſo ſee iobs meening although hee able breake ſcatter great throng people ſay although great might credite authoritie yet notwithſtanding ouerawe men ſtoppe mouth abaced himſelfe ſo farre feare ſuch moſt deſpized ofcaſtes raſcals common laughing ſtocks proueth well former ſaying verie good ſigne iob ment hide face ſeing mildneſſe feare baſeſt ſort vvee knowe man rich ſome gifte ſhall ſo authoriſed among men euery man ſhall feare ſtande awe open mouth although ſhould commit fault world yet men durſt ſpeak againſt except muttering ſecrete man might haue libertie ſay behold ſuch man misbehaueth himſelfe againe ſuch one aduaunced ſo high haue brute going ſteppe forth ſay haue body ſpeake mee take maruelouſly ſauing honour worſhip vvee ſee common thing world maruel ſeeing euen time iob thoſe credite abuſed theyr ryches honour mainteyning themſelues euill ſtopping mennes mouthes ſhoulde wiſe ſpeake vnpardonable offence man ſhoulde rebuke prince courte lawleſſe perſon authoritie iuſtice bee great ſturre kept ſuche man honour bee touched although many thing worthy blame inſomuch euen little child could tell faultes yet notwithſtanding men muſt bee whiſt contrarywiſe beholde iob ſayeth able breake throng people ſay able onely ſubdue mine enimies alſo bruſe breake peeces although whole worlde ſette themſelues agaynſt yet notwithſtanding ſuch credite power could well haue gotten vpper hand thē hee ſheweth meeke lambe hee ſuffered man reproue fault although ſome raſcall begger ſayeth yet ſtoode awe aſhamed hee ſpake mee acknowledged ſinnes taryed till ſome great armie rayſed till ſome greate menne came put mee ſhame giue care baſeſt ſort worlde ſee plaine meening text principall poynt learne take profit doctrine firſt let ſuch authoritie aboue others remember muſt make cloke couer filthineſſe looking glaſſe ſee howe god hath exalted high degree ende euill ſhould noted vndoubtedly good reaſon thoſe god hath graunted degree honour aboue neighbour ſhoulde indeuer themſelues ſhewe good example ſeeing ſo highly exalted contrarie theyr offence ſo much greeuouſer god hath iuſt cauſe vpbrayde ſaying haue aduaunced thee haue reached thee hande end thou ſhouldeſt burning creſſet giue light whole worlde ſeeing thou haſt giuen occaſion offence thy ſhame muſt needes greater therefore let thoſe whome god hath ſet ſtate honour vnderſtand ende ſhould haue greater libertie euill able ſtoppe plaine folkes mouthes muſt vſe ſuch buckler go couer burie faultes ſort god vtter greater vengeance agaynſt laying open ſhame marke one poynt therwithall let meaner ſort haue conſideration thē none v commeth nere ſuch authoritie iob attributeth owne perſon wee able breake throng people beare downe great bandes men may ryſe vp agaynſt v hardly wee fight ſnayle therefore meanes god holdeth v humilitie although bee agaynſt will vvhat matter would preſume ſhet mouthes thoſe haue iuſt cauſe ſpeake euill v nothing leſſe thā nothing yet notwithſtanding would ſtill reputation haue honour mainteyned man ſhould touch man ſpeake wee thinke heauen earth ought bee turned vpſide downe taking away defamation pray fighting directly againſt nature although god exalted v giuen v meane mainteyne honour yet heare ſayde behoueth v ſtand awe baſeſt ſort nowe ſeeing god giueth v brydle reineth v ſhort ende ſhould ſuffer fault bee knowne vvhat excuſe fall ſtriuing agaynſt thus ye ſee meaner ſort ought humble themſelues double conſidering ſee ſuche mirrour perſon iob wheras hee able beare downe great multitude yet ſubmitted himſelf ſuch ſort ſuffer ſelf reproued meaneſt ſort yea euen ſuche counted beggerlieſt others vvherefore let v haue mildneſſe ſuffer ſelues reproued great ſmall thus yee ſee wee haue marke firſt place therewithall houeth v alſo wey wel word deſpiſed behold cauſe maketh v ſo proude wee cannot corrected looking men whether equal ſeeme better ſelues wee thinke haue aduantage ouer v shall ſuch one take vpon rebuke mee better woorth furthermore contented eſteeme men equalles though much better caſt vnder foote wee good skill note mennes vyces yea inhaunce ſaying vvho men knowe hath done many thing amiſſe meane owne faultes ſmoothed cleare v vice made vrtue thing rocketh v aſleepe ſuch pride cannot receiue yoke correction whē god ſendeth men vnto v finde fault v ſhewe v howe greatly bee blame therfore ſo much behoueth v marke howe iob ſayeth feared moſt deſpiſed ſay euen ſuche offſcourings filth worlde yea euen verieſt raſcalles whome dignitie thing elſe wee ſee god v honour warne v men great eſtimation credit doth therefore followe ſhould deſpiſe warning men giue v proof hereof firſthing wee ought thinke man reproueth v meſſanger ſent vnto v god inſomuch little childe ſhoulde ſpeake v conſcience tell v hee ſayeth truth reſiſt god bee wilfull agaynſt therefore let v ſay deſerueth heard let v looke vpon meſſage bringeth v bee god let v ſtoupe downe head receyue yoke mark one point ſeconde let v marke oftentimes thoſe wee ſo deſpiſe much better ſelues nothing blindeth v owne hypocriſie bicauſe ſerche owne vice ought yet meane ouereagre againſt neighbour cauſe maketh v ſo reiect worthy heard receyued therefore let v ſtrippe ſelues pryde learne feele owne wretchedneſſe yea feele ſuch wiſe wee may abaſhed wee well worthy therewithall let v haue ſuch eie vice neighbour ſhould looke vpon vertues god hath put intoo honour thus ye ſee cauſe v receiue correction paciently againe yet one reſpect wee bee warned men value eſtimation muſt thinke ourſelues beholde god intendeth put ſhame deſerue hee ſhould ſende mee man reputation worldwarde could rayſe vp ſome prophete could ſend mee ſome man wiſe honourable vertues hee haue ſubdued one deſpiſed reiected mē end make mee feele diſeaſe better warned ſome man authoritie ouer would think wel ſhame thee ſtriue agaynſt ſuch man would cauſe mee nouriſhe ſtill ſome pride mee beholde god commeth buffet mee ſort hee ſuffereth mee haue ſome good freend counſell mee ſome man good countenaunce warne mee ſafegarde mine honeſtie ſendeth mee outcaſt seeing thus mee muſt needes acknowledge god doeth without cauſe lo wee meanes brought reaſonableneſſe fearing meaneſt moſt deſpyſed ſort moreouer iob ſayeth went doores meeneth vſed back ſhrinkings refrayned himſelfe willingly ſuffring himſelf bee condemned without gainſaying hyding himſelf man conuicted effect thing haue note true man may ſometymes hyde himſelfe yet ceaſe chawe vpon bit ſeeke reuengement agaynſt ſuche haue defamed whereas ſayd iob went doores ment hee ende hee woulde heare reproch meane practiſe bee reuenged enimies ſuche ſlaundered hilde himſelfe within houſe rid place ſuch gone rebuke faultes gaue full ſcope ſhould ſay ſet ſelf againſt ſend men mainteyn quarell let condemne mee whole worlde keepe mee locked vp priſon vve know man priſon men haue libertie inough commence action againſt iob wil kept himſelf priſoner end ſuffer men condemne wel worthy noted ſee nowadays man giltieſt world vnderſtand men ſpeake heare ſome windie word remedie come open ſtreet iuſtle ſhoulders ſome like boare keepe coyle mainteyn euill bring route ſaying get vpper hād whatſoeuer come haue ſpoken euill find meanes ſtoppe mouthes ſpeake euill vvould god example hereof ſo manifeſt bee man cannot open eies ſhall ſee ouerordinarie vice ſuch ſpite god world ſowe abroade corruption euery vtterly ſhameleſſe ſhew thēſelues poſſeſſed diuel come forth facing bracing forehead harlot haue wiped ſnoute well againe whatſoeuer matter offence ſhall ſo ſhamefull aire ſhall ſtink yet ſhall men dare ſpeake one worde muſt fayne giue place thoſe royſters seeing vice reigneth euery wee haue ſo muche neede marke leſſon ſhewed wit haue offended muſt willingly kepe ſelues priſoners ſeeke meanes bridle ſelues ſuffer men condemne v god may acquite v true holding ſelues muſt cloke ſinnes keeping ſilence howbeit let v meane bee quiet come abrode like brazenfaced fellowes mainteyne vyces nother let v ſtriue agaynſt god rather conſider wee blame worthie reſpectes maieſtie therefore remedie v flee infinite grace mercie vſeth towards poore ſinners returne vnto nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele conuicted wee may followe father adam vſing outleapes thinke ſhalbe quiet ſhrinking aſide rather may conſider howe wee bee damnable thervpon flee mercie alſo lerne ſory feele ſhame men intent wee haue diſcouered god angelles wee may bowe vnder maieſtie ſhall dreadfull vnto v bycauſe reconcyled vnto meanes lorde ieſus chriſt foraſmuch cannot liue world without feeling vice imperfection ouermuch may pleaſe guide v continually holy ſpirit vntil hee haue clothed v throughly owne rightuouſneſſe may pleaſe graunt grace c cxviij sermon eight vpon xxxj chapter 35 oh ſomebodie heare marke almightie ſhould anſvvere let mine aduerſarie vvright booke 36 beare vpon ſhoulders vvill take itto crovvne 37 vvill recken ſteppes vvill preſent ſelfe prince 38 lande crie agaynſt furrovves thereof vveepe togither 39 haue eaten foy ſon vvithout ſiluer haue oppreſſed ovvners vvith ſorrovv 40 let bring forth thiſtles ſteade vvheate darnell ſteade barley ende iobs vvordes haue ſeene heretofore iob cō plyned god harkened might obteyne reaſon hande truly ſaying ſo intent blaſpheme though god bin cruell vniuſt meening hee knewe vvas ſo afflicted lawfull go lawe god though hee knewe reaſon proceeding herewithall addeth deſire god ſhould anſwere vvherein hee doeth v wit god would bee ſo gracious ſhewe hee ſo tormented knowledge ſhoulde ſuffize howbeit apparant reaſon ſhould handled ſo roughly ſeing life bin without blame indeuered walk holyneſſe true word anſwer may expounded two wayes wit god ſhould come aduerſarie partie lay forth reaſons article elſe ſhould anſwere ſay ſhould declare himſelfe bee iobs ſide howbeeit foraſmuch heeretofore hath oftentimes ſayde god woulde condiſcend ſhewe cauſe iuſtice ſhoulde ſuffice take text ſayde deſire god ſhoulde ſhewe reaſon ſcourgeth common reſpecte vtterly deſpize defie whole world let haue ſtrong partie put accuſation againſt mee yea let make great booke ſhall greeue carry vpon ſhoulder ſhall heauy burthen mee rather ſhall crowne ornamēt deck withall ſee effect iob ment ſay namely bin ſuch mā reputed taken according wee ſee freends cōdemned reprobate bycauſe indured ſo greate torment ſeemed vntoo god ment vtter vengeance intent iob ſhould mirrour wicked men god doth vtterly deſtroy iob therfore proteſteth ſuch man therewithall deſireth haue audience men onely god ſhould anſwere ſay god ſhoulde make rightuouſneſſe knowne woulde hee mainteyne ſuffering ſinnes namely thing might bee throughly conſidered god would pronounce ſentence way ordinarie proces prerogatiue high ſecrete power ſo men might knowe worketh maner wee haue ſeene heretofore without cauſe iob ſhould make wiſh diuerſe time god chaſticeth v according threatnings ſet downe lawe wit wee bee puniſhed reaſon ſinnes moſt ordinarie maner ye ſee god ſuffered miſdeedes vnpuniſhed giuen v rule whereby liue well added threatnings ſaying ye breake commaundements puniſhe warre peſtilence famin ſickneſſe pouertie diuers thing vvell beaten god roddes behoueth v lay life law find ſelues haue done amiſſe inditement throughly framed iudgement already giuen vpon v remayneth nothing execution thus ſee ordinarie maner god vſeth chaſtizing men iob reſpect puniſhed ſins deſerued creature ſo rightuous exempt himſelf god correction yet haue declared afore god reſpect iobs offence hee puniſhed meaſure reaſon miſdeedes trie faith pacience ſeruant alſo make example al world meane iob mouth ſhet ſo hee wiſt ſay
