therefore behoueth v enquire cauſe handled ſo roughly ſecret vnknowne men without cauſe iob deſireth god anſwere ſay enter plea ſuffer mainteyne owne ſoundneſſe let know indureth ſuch torment herewithall let v marke lawfull men chalenge god ſort good reaſon hee ſhoulde handle v hys owne pleaſure ſhould ſtoupe although cauſe iudgements bee apparant vntoo v pleaſe god viſit v rigour wee ſee hee doth yet muſt wee keepe mouth ſhet murmur agaynſt neuertheleſſe haue open ſtill glorifie confeſsing although iudgements bee bottomleſſe deepe yet ceaſe iuſt rightfull thus ye ſee wee haue note good faith terrible thing god ſhould enter lawe v ſet himſelſe agaynſt v ala ſhall become v fall prouoking deſire go lawe great confuſion doctrine well worthie bee noted wee ſee howe men doo dayly fall murmuring grudging themſelues elſe prouoke god deſire go lawe ſhall bring matter well paſſe true skirmiſh faſhion bee afflicted ſay woulde haue god agaynſt meane whyle marke ſhoote man bee impacient affliction holde himſelfe quiet yeelding god good take correction hande pray doth lift vp himſelfe intent god ſo prouoked wrath ſhould maynteyne owne right let v kepe ſelues quarelling god ſtryketh v rod haue deadly enimie let v learne rather ſubmit v vnto hande like well doth although reaſon thereof bee hidden v time surely wee ought deſire earneſtly may pleaſe god ſhewe v ſcourgeth v howbeeit muſt bee done ende profit ſelues correction applie chaſticements inſtruction know cauſe therfore euery v feeling owne ſinnes ſorie hee hath offended god aſhamed owne lewdneſſe therevpon humbleth himſelfe ſeeking remedie turne away euill ſay meanes indeuer apply god correction owne vſe make turne ſuch diſcipline may ſhewe ſelues vtterly paſt amendment may well maner deſire god make v vnderſtande ſcourgeth v end hys correction vaine liſt vſe power holde v ignorance ſo wee know vſeth ſo great rigor againſt v yet muſt wee ſuche extremitie caſt downe heades flee refuge vnto haue declared alredie namely god rightuous reſpectes therefore although wee knowe cauſe hee afflicteth v yet wee muſt ceaſſe glorifie continually lo wee haue marke ſtreyne heerewithall let v come iob ſayeth marke ſayeth hee almightie ſhoulde anſwere mine aduerſarie wright booke behoue mee beare bee aſhamed cary ſhall like offendour indyted condemned booke ſhall rather maynteyne ſoundneſſe durſt ſayth dock ſelfe crowne vvhen iob ſpeaketh ſo hee meeneth accuſations whiche layde agaynſt falſe hee bene wrongfully ſlaundered cōſidering liued innocently howbeeit ſaying ſo meeneth bin vtterly cleare ſo fault found ſeene yeſterday hath confeſſed himſelf ſinner yea proteſted hee hid faultes men woont doo according wee ſee men hypocriſie ſuch euery man woulde fayne hyde himſelfe vayne tryfling lurkingholes iob declared intended ſuch thing hee freely condemned ſelfe done amiſſe yea taryed till men authoritie reproued ſuffered himſelfe bee ſhamed moſt deſpiſed ſort humbled himſelf ſo low receyue correction thoſe worthie looke vpon text iob meeneth vtterly without ſinne ſtayne contrarietie wordes layeth forth cace according haue ſeene ſay hee reprobate although god handled roughly yet folowed heynous faultes ſome ſecrete cauſe vve ſee effect iob ment exalt himſelfe againſt god ſuch pride many vphold thēſelues rightuous yea euē without feeling ſinnes haue cōmitted although liued angel yet notwithſtanding knew well god might find ſufficient cauſe puniſh neuertheleſſe mainteineth vncorruptneſſe intent ſeparate himſelf nūber deſpiſers god hereby taught meane v mainteyne good cace vvee knowe moſt faultie good moſt bolde iuſtifie themſelues rebuked although condemnation apparant ynough euery man doeth ſee bee nothing worth yet notwithſtanding bee moſt ſhameleſſe mainteyning themſelues bee faultleſſe affirme themſelues haue great wrong bee reproued contrariwyſe although god child haue indeuered walke aright yet notwithſtanding firſt thing yeeld themſelues guiltie acknowledge themſelues bee wretched ſinners therevpon wee ſee man go iuſtifie himſelfe without exception hee vndertaketh warre againſt god whoſoeuer ſayeth ſinner intendeth make god lier ſayeth siohn canonicall epiſtle god hath pronounced one generall ſentence vpon v experience alſo ought ſhewe v v ought flee god mercie refuge iuſtifie himſelfe without exception warreth manifeſtly agaynſt god iuſtleth ſhall winne ende nothing muſt wee haue acknowledged fault reprōued thing feele ſelues guiltie let v caſt downe heades acknowledge ſelues haue deſerued god ſhoulde put v ſuch ſhame bee condemned men yea euen baceſt ſort haue iudges wee knowe wee haue offended thing whereof wee accuſed god meening humble v another ſort neuertheleſſe behoueth v receiue correction paciently finally men reproue v raſhneſſe beare v downe wee offender whereas knowe contrarie hypocriſie v graunt ſuch ſlaunders true man accuſed robberie whordome murther cleere ſo might proteſt god angel ſuch thing hee doo condemne himſelfe hee doth euill may well mainteyne clearneſſe maner iob doth onely reſpect honeſtie vainglorious ſort wiſe touched al ſo tender honour cannot ſuffer bee touched though haue deſamed themſelues would haue ſhame couered yet meane whyle themſelues blaze abroade ſo euery man knoweth vve muſt go way worke euery man muſt caſe iudge himſelfe hee ought neighbour muſt learne condemne euill allowe good without accepting perſons lo maner wee may maynteyne good quarell cauſe iob ſayeth god would anſwere mee though men vpon earth ſhoulde bende themſelues agaynſt mine aduerſarie partie alledge poſsible ſhall ſo farre beeing aſhamed beare ſhall take crowne deck withall ſhall ornament vnto herewithall let v marke alſo intende mainteyne owne innocencie ynough v hyde ſhame men oure princypall poynt muſt bee god may bee warrant anſwere v true anſwere iob ſpeaketh ment haue declared wit god ſhoulde enter ordinarie proces againſt ſhew cauſe ſcourge • yet therewithall iob pretendeth god would giue libertie mainteyne caſe woulde make ſide reiected bicauſe extreme affliction ſhould founde lyers haue touched afore ſee purpoſe haue eſcaped mē muſt ſpecially haue eye vnto god bring oure good cace ſayd may warrant wee receyue ſentence diſcharge hande would god well printed harte ſee nowadayes one v ſo may bee releaſed world ſeeke nothing ſo god deſpiſed none v thinketh euer hee ſhall render account looke man may byte v man come aſſayle v may haue wherwith keepe therefore ſo eſcaped worlde wee thinke ſafe ſo meane whyle thing maketh v bolde exalt ſelues againſt god wherfore let v think wel vpon doctrine wit wretched reward world ſhall ſoothe v god allowe v therefore aboue thing let euery man examin himſelf let done owne fancie according god lawe knowe bee competent iudges behoueth v receyue iudgement lawe thing ſayd conteyned let god ſeat ſet vp hauing hys worde eye let v conſider throughly whether wee haue walked hee commaundeth whether wee haue ſwarued worde wee haue done amiſſe let v learne condemne ſelues furthermore hee graunt v grace obey although many vice v yet notwithſtanding ſo cheef marke haue bin obey let content v bee allowed though worlde condemne v let greeue v world chargeth v ſlanders ſo god reache v hande accept v ſhewe liketh well life vvhē point let dogges barke v ſo long cannot byte v although ſeeme report enimies bee wickeddeſt men worlde yet let v beare thing paciently thing haue marke text ſo wee ſee two poynts note one muſt giue ſelues ambition vanitie ſeeke praiſe men exempt ſelues god iudgement contrariwiſe behoueth v feele howe terrible god wrath examin wel conſciences end faultie vvhen haue obteyned ſay god hath graunted v grace walke vprightly ſo ſure alloweth v let v beare ſlaunders falſe accuſations worlde paciently tary till god ſhewe ſoundneſſe openly make ſhyne breake daye according hath promiſed ſeconde poynt yet notwithſtanding touching iob ſayeth beare booke ſhall bee made agaynst crowne ſay proces wherby ſhall charged ſort fault ment alwayes honour vntoo v afore men haue good cace ſurely vnpoſsible finde better caſe sainct paules ſerued god faythfully office yet notwithſtanding fayled bee charged accuſed falſly doth hee aſmuch hee ſeeth men blinde ignorant iudge wrongfully appealeth day god appeale ſayeth day lorde ye ſee ſaint paule conſtreyned vſe ſuch remedie according oftentimes commeth paſſe bee defaced worlde holdeth v wicked ſo diſgraced bycauſe wicked ſo ſhameleſſe one ſpeake euill men hooke crooke yet meane wee ſhall ceaſſe go ſtill heades vpright may appeale vnto god warrant wee ſee prophtes doo vvhen ieremie ſayeth lorde deceyuer thou haſt deceyued mee bycauſe layd charge nothing beguile people vvell ſayeth ſay hath god deceyued mee vvhen ſpeaketh maner hee meeneth deceyt guile god doth boldly repreſſe ſlaunders layde vpon ſaying arme ſelues agaynſt god knowe maynteyne quarell eſay reporting hee reiected men greatly reproched deſpiſed could ſayth yet lord anſwere whenſoeuer wee bee defaced oppreſſed men blamed whole world yet ſhal fayle haue crowne glorie wee haue recorde god cauſe iob ſayeth hee ouerthrowe ſlaunders ſhall bee layde agaynſt ſayeth come offender condemned already himſelf information put agaynſt hee conuicted owne conſcience miſdeede hee hath done come prince vndoubtedly child god iudges iudges whē wrongfully oppreſſed men certaine dare boldly appeare referring thēſelues wholly vnto god reſting thoſe dare condemne malice violence tirannie vvhereas enimies truth adayes condemne faithfull burned therof ſit vnder clothes eſtate think gallowes honorable wherō martyr ſhall tormented ſtake ſet vp childe god turned yes ſurmounteth throne world king prince together iudges muſt needes wickedneſſe vnhallowe ſeats hallowed dedicated vnto god foraſmuch ſit muſt need full filthineſſe infectiō bycauſe followe wil hath ſet ſo make thoſe place ſhamefull deteſtable whiche notwithſtanding theirſelues honorable contrariwiſe although ſtake gibbet lothſomething worldward yet notwithſtanding certayne martyr childe god bringeth good conſcience thither ſuffereth good quarrell ſanctifieth ſame ſorte curſed thē nought iob ſayth god wilbe ſo gratious aunſwere ſaye giue leaue mayntayne innocency heare declare life come lofty countenāce like prince drooping like offendour boldly receyue bookes written againſt taking ornament croune garland alſo ought comfort v namely walking vprightneſſe god indeuering ſerue honour thē world vnthankfull men v wrong degrade v maketh matter ſo proteſt god caſe good alſo able ſhewe ſo drawne men ſhamefull thing ſay god witneſſe reſt doings aunſwerable according many men call god record raſhly yet knowne clean cōtrarie allowed god muſt ſo deale world may beare witneſſe vprightneſſe whē commeth hearing muſt haue mouth open declare matter goeth diſproue ſlaunders ſhall layde againſt v furthermore whē haue ſay whē haue good record faultie god alſo ſhewe ſame deede although men make bookes againſt v ſay although deface v ſo many blame ſlaūders ſhal ſeeme houge moūtaynes yet ſhall ſame heauy burthen v bycauſe ſhall vphild god hand reſt ourſelues vppon rather ſhall make crowne garland vnto v much better v ſo blamed world god ſhould allowe v flattered ſides ſame ſhould excuſe v according ſee many take libertie euill deſpiſe god bycauſe world ſootheth reaſon ſo many mē runne ſquare giue themſelues bridle euill bycauſe haue bin ſpared mēnes eye haue ben ſhet wink wicked doings lo cauſe deſtruction much better lord ſhoulde bee warrant meane whyle whole world bee againſt v prayſed commended world meane whyle haue heauē crye vengeaunce againſt v vve ſee pope exalted nowadayes holineſſe although monſter diuell incernate yet men bowe giue greater title honour god meane whyle cauſe augment damnation much ſayd iuſtifie world ende world alſo ſhould receiue flatter ſinnes contrariwiſe haue ſayd let v learne looke continually vnto god meane whyle hee ſuffer v bee vniuſtly condemned men let v ſuffer paciently ceaſe beare head ſtill vpright furthermore according whiche ſayd concerning reckening ſteppes let v bee ready yeeld account whenſoeuer ſhall accuſed cryme let v thinke ſcape god iudgement concealing miſdeede v let v conſider behoueth v aunſwere ourſelues although men doo iuſtifie v yet cannot hyde thing v god iob hath ſpoken ſo added laſt proteſtation full knitting vp land ſayeth haue cried furrowes thereof complaine haue eaten foyſon without money thoſe haue tilled complaine haue oppreſſed let mee eate tristles inſteade wheate darnell inſteade barley hereby iob concludeth whiche wee haue ſeene afore wit although bin greuouſly afflicted hand god yet notwithſtanding men ought haue condemned though bene greater offender others whome god ſpared haue ſayd god keepeth one rate afflicting men sometime hee puniſheth ſinnes otherwhyles whē intendeth viſite owne ſeruaunts extreme rigor reſerueth cauſe afflictiōs himſelfe although haue ſerued indeuored frame themſelues wholly righteouſneſſe yet therfore forbeare ſend right greate affliction caſe knowe ſay vntill laſt day god ſhall manifeſt thing vnto v whiche hidden iob ſheweth wee muſt eſteeme lyfe according ſtate wherein although bee miſerableſt men outward ſight yet doeth proteſt hee deſire ſerue god wherein ſheweth wee haue heretofore ſeene many proteſtations laſt land cried true earth hath mouth cry complaine nother hath feeling ſuffer wrong hand nother ſemeth earth wrong inſomuch although could ſpeake yet mā wold ſay cauſe either cry wepe make complainte againſt v vvhat doeth iob meene ſaying land complayned furrowes wept meneth earth ſelfe hath cauſe complayne holy ſcripture vſeth ſuch maner ſpeche make v perceiue better greater vehemencie amiſſe god creature ſhall againſt v beare witneſſe againſt v haue oppreſſed poore labourer til earth giue v foode haue vſed extortiō againſt thē haue plucked away good ſhall beare witneſſe againſt v earth whiche haue tilled ſhall alſo depoſe againſt v why▪ haue beſtowed ſweate blood greate cruelty v whē think earth behalf hath opened bowel according order god hath fet yelded frute ſhee tilled earth thē hath hir dutie wrought hir labourer ther mutuall agreement betwixt thē yet notwithſtanding behold seagulfes deuoure foyſon earth taking away men good thouſand extortion laborer complaine muſt earth alſo hir parte anſwere hath bin tormented yee ſee holy ſcripture vſeth ſuch ſpeech wee ſee hardneſſe v ſo much mā tel v ſinnes think ſelues quite diſcharged may find ſome prety ſtarting hole although cōuicted thē god yet ſo afraide bee ſory feele dreadful wrath god therfore behoueth v ſpurred aſſes folke vtterly hardened inſomuch whē god ſtriketh vpō v mayne ſtrokes vpon ſtones ſoften v make v yeld ſtithies anuildes except force thus ye ſee haue marke ſo oftē ſcripture ſpeaketh maner namely earth crieth hir furrowes aske vengeāce let v vnderſtand god reproueth ſtubborneſſe ſheweth v ſo blinded ſinnes cannot come knowledge except drawe v ſome violent meanes marke well point therfore let v continue hardharted whē ſee lord vſeth ſuch vehemencie againſt v wake v withal leaſtwiſe let v enter examination fault bee caſt downe lo haue marke therwithall alſo muſt come earth mē ſaid righteouſe mā wil haue care horſe oxe aſſe wicked men turmoyle brethrē neyghbours eating vp ſuſtenance life without equitie therfore heare ſpeaking earth beaſts let v vnderſtand end ſhould indifferent towards neighbour fleſh blood ſelf ſame nature wee ſelues vſe tyrānie crueltie thing muſt need fulfilled v ſaid holy ſcripture namely withholding wage ſuch haue trauayled taken paine profit ſhall cry vnto heauen creature ſhall beare witneſſe wrong extortiō haue neighbour according alſo prophet abacuk ſpeketh ſaying walles houſes builded deceyte extortion ſhal cry loude ſhirle play quirreſters behalf terme thē ſo ſhall anſwere one another either ſide one ſide ſingeth behold blud behold murther one behold deceipt behold crueltie one behold pilling polling behold couetuouſneſſe one behold periury behold robberie another behold ſpightfulneſſe let v marke wel according wee ſhall haue abuſed creature god ſo muſt aske vengeance againſt v latter daye therfore let v take warning hereby walke ſuch cōſcience wee may go head vpright perfect god beare iudgement vengeance rather maye pleaſe receiue v infinite goodnes ſo guide v holy ſpirit may apply indeuer ſerue good conſcience according grace ſhall haue giuen v let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele wee may haue whole recourſe vnto mercy therewithall euery v ſo inforce himſelfe walk pureneſſe life may able power holy ſpirit reſiſt tēptatiōs follow whether ſoeuer cal v iuſtly proteſt wee haue ſerued liuing god ſought nothing glorifie name becommeth chriſtians performaunce wherof may pleaſe graūt time life may ſeke altogether pleaſe meanes edifie one another drawe euen ſilly ignorant ſort light goſpel whervnto good god calleth v grace ſame end may pleaſe c cxix sermon firſt vpon xxxij chapter theſe three men left ſpeaking iob bycauſe eſteemed himſelf righteouſe 2 eliu sonne barachel buzite houſe ram angrie ſore diſpleazed iob bycauſe ſayd rightuouſe god 3 alſo angrie three freends bycauſe made none aunſwer yet condemned iob wee may fare better whiche conteined thing ſhall ſee hereafter muſt beare mind wee haue ſeene heeretofore namely iob hauing vndertaken good caſe hādle amiſſe thoſe came cōfort hauing vndertaken euill caſe vſed good argumēts apparāt reaſons wherof profitable doctrine might gathered therfore ther fault thē bycauſe laid good foūdatiō faulte iob bycauſe builded amiſſe vppon foundation good ſelfe cauſe ſaid eliu buzite angry inflamed wrath bycauſe thoſe ſaid men diſproued iob yet notwithſtanding condēned alſo angry iob bycauſe went iuſtifie himſelfe god ſee anger elius without cauſe aſwell againſt iob againſt three frends came comfort although iob iuſt reaſonable quarrell yet farre ouerſhote himſelf although alledged good reaſons yet reſiſt god reaſoning euill purpoſe meane whole ſaid iobs three freends left diſpute againſt bycauſe hee thought himſelfe righteouſe vve haue ſeene iob made ſo great accompt owne righteouſneſſe thought many fault found therfore contrary parte proteſteth himſelf wretched ſinner howbeit wold condēne himſelf thoſe iudged amiſſe afflictiō opinion imagination iobs three freends iob caſtaway god bycauſe hee handled ſo roughly ſayd ought iudge diſcretly party god correcteth muſt cōclude euery mā puniſhed according offence time god ſpareth wicked wincketh miſdedes ſorer damnation ſhall pay right dere god goodneſſe tarrying thē ſo paciētly god ſometimes make coūtenance puniſhing thoſe haue deſerued let v therfore think haue made better market nother let v iuſtifie thē bycauſe god ſpareth thē contrariwiſe whē ſee man beaten god ſcourges let v therfore think wickeder reſt world may god trye pacience puniſh ſinnes iob would cō ſent fonde doctrine freendes cauſe ſeemed iuſtifie himſelfe though ment ſuch thing therfore hath ben hertofore ſhewed let v beware vndertaking euill quarrell ſhall blinded ſeeme v man agree fully v ſo condemned ought haue talke enter diſputatiō let v wel aſſured truth nothing worſe haſty know theſe ordinary prouerbes continually put vre amongs v namely haſt maketh waſt foles bolt ſoone ſhot seing ſo let v learne hold iudgement ſuſpence vntill throughly aſſured truth herewithall let v marke oftentimes may happen ſhall wrōgfully cōdemned men although ſuch backbite v haue mouthes ſtopped haue reaſon conuince v withall yet wil ceaſe caried away ſuch ſpite ſlaunder v caſt foorth wicked word againſt v hereby warned men bee ſo maliciouſe cōdemne v without proof muſt take much hart noueltie happened iob excellent ſeruant god day ſee papiſts thinke ynough haue decreed lewd error ſuperſtitions falſe doctrine good ſteppe mayſterly ſtyle ynough haue determined ſo entring diſputation ſerching reaſon thing go owne ſeeming haue authoritie therevppon thunder againſt v meane ſeazō know truth ſides fully reſolued vvherfore let v reſiſt ſuch temptation abaſhed ſeing tymes reaſon themſelues haue notwithſtāding ceaſſed condēne good caſe boldly without remorſe cōſcience seing thē diuel blindeth thē ſo let v always kepe ou • courſe ſticke ſtedfaſtly truth knowe owne part alſo let v take warning walk leyſurely whē haue ben anywhit haſty oftentimes fall childrē god ſhal ouerſeene haue ſtay ynough ourſelues therfore let v go ſtill neither let raſhneſſe bee matched wilfulneſſe truely hard thing hath ouerſhot himſelfe doth commonly become wilfull howbeit haue done amiſſe muſt cōtinue euill rather learne reſtreine ſelues ſaying haue exceded meaſure know well haue bridled ſelf ſuch modeſtie ought vvhat oh muſt harden myſelfe ſeing haue taken wrong way muſt returne backe againe ye ſee exāple iobs freends holy ghoſt warneth v firſt wel aduiſed take quarrel hād raſhly againſt god ſecōdly happen ouerſeene muſt wiſe wilfull proceede euil acknowledge fault labour amend hand concerning eliu mencion made without cauſe ſcripture ſheweth v ſtock came according named buzite houſe ram wee ſee firſt aūcientneſſe touched heretofore the▪ principal point alſo god mēt declare vnto v hath always remained ſome good ſeede religiō among thoſe wrapped many fond fancy notable point knowe world hand fall away god men turned aſide corruptiō lie meene euen immediatly floud notwithſtanding vengeaunce god ſo horrible worthy remembraunce child noe whiche eſcaped hauing liued long time might tell child ſucceſſors maner god taken vengeaunce wickedneſſe world notwithſtanding yet fell away forſooke right religion turning aſide vnto lie idolatrie diſorders herein ſee men exceeding frayle nothing harder hold feare god good religion true reſpecte euill wee bee ſtedfaſt wee cannot bee bowed aſide man wold go amend euill v knoweth whīch ende begin nother bring paſſe bycauſe ſuche piteouſe hardhartedneſſe v goodneſſe wee forgoe byandby needeth nothing thruſt v vvee haue faire mirroure hereof ſhewed v men went aſtray forſooke pure knowledge god ſo ſoone flud notwithſtanding told withall wee ſee example perſone eliu god hath always left ſome good ſeede middeſt darkneſſe hath alwayes bin ſome good holy doctrine end vnbeleeuers ſhoulde bee left vnexcuſable ſo coulde alledge ignorance reygned ouer wherof came god ſerued woorſhipped purely men turned backes vpon dyd ſimplicitie wherevnto might gyue ſome colour honeſtie rather ſtubborne wilfulneſſe men loth beguiled yea ſeeme beguiled whē cōmeth ſeruing god ſhet eye quench light ſhyned ſeeke nothing giue ouer themſelues trumperie thing ſhewed v behoueth v way wel hath bin treated heeretofore namely althoughe theſe men prophet god yet notwithſtandyng doctrine proceeded ſuch maieſtie might ryght well beſeeme perſon prophet true haue ſayd miſapply yet notwithſtanding excellent ſpirit deede haue declared afore thing haue bin ſet ought bee receyued ſchole holy ghoſt although theſe perſonages ſo excellent yet taught lawe moyſes ſeparated churche god lawe publiſhed time whych thyng vncerteyne yet diſtant countrey iury felowſhippe might bee partaker doctrine whiche god ſimply appoynted people vve ſee men ſcripture thing ſaue doctrine whiche noe child ſpr •• abroade fludde prophetes god haue excellent ſpirit although dwelt ſtraunge countrey yet ſee god giuen knowledge ſufficient edifie common people thus ye ſee world could bee excuſed ignorance although idolatrie reigned time thare nacor themſelues alſo idolators ſayd laſt chapter booke ioſua thoſe whiche came folowed theyr ſteppes yet notwithſtanding elia houſe ram three exempted common corruption tyme ſo wee ſee pure religion quite aboliſhed among ſufficient doctrine leade god conuince worlde wilfulneſſe ignoraunce thus yee ſee haue marke firſt place alſo heare ſayde god gaue men ouer walke deſtruction let v mark well bycauſe ſo graciouſe men giue peculiar doctrine whych hee reſerued owne people churche yet excuſe god therefore let men runne aſtray drouned deſtruction neuertheleſſe continued alwayes ſome ſeede theyr hart whereby ſo conuicted could ſay knewe god religion nother could cleare hymſelfe aboade ingrauen conſciences world made ſelfe heauenly maieſtie wherevnto muſt needes bee ſubiect verely sainct paule ſpeaketh expreſly record god hath imprinted creature inſomuch order world booke teach v ought lead v vnto god howbeeit heerewithall behoueth v come treated ſecond chapter romaine namely god hath grauen ſuch certeintie cōſciences cannot wipe away knowledge haue good euill euery man hath ſo muche knowledge wee heare iobs three freends yet notwithſtanding ſhall neuer find man ſo rude barbarouſe hee hath ſome remorſe conſcience knoweth god hath ſome diſcretion condemne euill allowe good god hathe left theſe trace crankes hart ignoranteſt ende men myght couer themſelues excuſe condemned inditement laid vp within themſelues way let v marke fooliſhly done mē fight againſte god maintenaunce doctrine reygned among thē ſeeing knowledge god hath ſhyned ſo cleerely world men might inlightened wee haue ſeene afore poſsible ſhould gyue ouer themſelues ſo groſſe beaſtlineſſe worſhippe ſtocks ſtones honour sunne moone make puppet quite cleane forgette liuing god howe could come paſſe one man ſhuld wilfully runne headlong againſt thing high noone like ſtumbling drunken man reeleth aſyde though ſee right way eye vve ſee men ſwarued aſide ſimplicitie ſpighted god purpoſed malice therfore let v conſider well ende runne theſe wonted ſhifts ſay pray men bee ſo dazeled know thing concerning god ought ſerue excuſe man alledgeth let v contrary part take anſwere whiche ſayd sainct iohn namely light ſhined darkneſſe ſee ſame preſent example bin vnpoſsible men haue runne aſtray ſo groſſe outrageous ſuperſtitions wilfully throwne themſelues intoo ignoraunce therfore matched wilfulneſſe ſtubborneſſe forſooke right way ſaluation gaue themſelues ouer idol lo haue beare away warneth v ware walking whyle haue light v haue ſayd already god ſo graciouſe v ſhewe v way behoueth v make haſt time v ſleepe much leſſe ſhet oure eye wilfully day ſee greate darkneſſe reigneth ouer moſt parte world wretched papiſts go aſtray knowe god hath giuen ouer woorthy foraſmuch haue forgotten truthe vengeaunce muſt needes come vpon waterflood ouerwhelme drowne deſtructiō wee ſide haue ieſus chriſte sunne righteouſneſſe ſhineth vpon v therfore muſt haue • eye ſhet muſt walke whyle day laſteth following exhortation giuen v heere become guiltie wilfull defacing knowledge giuen v theſe dayes thus yee ſee wee haue marke firſt place ſentence touching anger eliu let v marke blamed heere inordinate paſsion good alowable miſliking bycauſe proceedeth zeale eliu toward god truth hee ſaw iob iuſtifie hym ſelfe ſuch wiſe eſteemed himſelfe righteouſe god iobs freends knowledge hyld opinion againſt wicked man iob declareth ſo hee indeede howbeeit haue ſayde exceeded meaſure although cace good yet handle amiſſe tooke euil way eliu therefore marketh iobs ouerſhoting himſelfe murmuring impaciencie therein hee wente iuſtifie himſelfe aboue god agayne angry thoſe tooke vpon euill caſe vnaduiſedly able compaſſe confounded came pintche behold eliu inflamed anger without cauſe foraſmuch zeale good therefore holy ghoſt allowed anger wrath way behoueth v marke ſaying iob intended iuſtifie himſelfe aboue god truely intent ſo would rather hūdred time earth ſwalowed vp neuer bin borne worlde haue thought ſuch blaſphemie truly haue told often ouerſhot himſelfe conclude fully ſo raging hys paſsions according hard men ſtay thē ſelues many paſsions ſhall oftentimes eſcape ye ſee cace iob end hee alwayes condemned himſelfe done amiſſe would excuſe ſayde hee intended iuſtifie himſelfe aboue god ſaying conteyneth good profitable doctrine taught may ſometimes happen blaſpheme god thinke ſort pleading againſt allow thing good whiche god doth ſpecially hee afflicteth v certayne wee would make ſelues rightuouſe god true ſay neither wyll wee thinke thing ſheweth ſelfe ynough condemne v wee doo glorifie god iuſtice allowing rightfull bee better vnderſtood example behold iob knoweth god righteous yea vnfeynedly acknowledgeth hym ſo owne part acknowledgeth himſelfe wretched ſinner many fault found yea ſhould quarell agaynſt god hee ſhoulde bee vanquiſhed thouſande tymes hee coulde aunſwere one poynte iob meeneth directly iuſtifie himſelfe aboue god make hymſelfe equall hym meane whyle ſayeth hee maruayle god afflicteth mee thus vvhat fault mee agayne poore creature full infirmitie meete god ſhoulde ſtretche oute ſtrong arme agaynſt mee vvhy doth kill hande vvhen iob runneth intoo ſo many murmuring grudgings doubt hee iuſtifieth himſelfe aboue god ſeemeth god vnreaſonable afflicting ſo bycauſe hee knewe done hee deſired god come thither aduerſarie partie afterwarde agayne hee angrie god conſumeth hand ſendeth hym quite away seeing iob ſo headie paſsions doubt ſo made himſelf rightuous god tolde euen namely wee ſhall oftentimes blaſpheme god paſsions ere wee thinke vvhiche thing ought cauſe v take heede wee giue oure paſsions brydle leaſt fall ſuch wretchedneſſe blaſpheme god ere aware doctrine profitable v holy ghoſt telleth v ſuche grudge murmure affliction cannot ſubmit themſelues mightie hande god confeſſe doings rightfull reaſonable make themſelues rightuous god although ſay proteſt hundred time neuer ment think yet neuertheleſſe ſo indeede behold competent iudge hath gyuen determinate ſentence vpon therefore kicking againſt ſhall gaine nothing remayneth learne firſt formoſt condemne ſelues bring inditement alwayes ready made come god ſay wretched ſinners furthermore god iudgements ſhall execute vpon v ſeeme ouerſharp vnto v lette v beare paciently without making great inquiry thinke ſtrange god ſhould handle v great rigour ſee reaſon doth miſerie ſeeme hard god ſpareth frailtie hath ſuch pitie v ought haue let v giue bridle fancy conſent vnto let v always beare minde god rightuous howſoeuer world go true wee ſhall perceyue reaſon hee doth whereof commeth oure owne infirmitie rudeneſſe meete wee ſhoulde meaſure god iuſtice witte vvhat preſumptuouſneſſe vvhat reaſon let v learne glorifie god al thing doth although hande bee rough towardes v yet let v ceaſſe co confeſſe ſtill ala lord go law thee know well cace ouerthrowne beholde ieremie proceedeth behalfe ſheweth v way thing haue although thing wer ſo great confuzion might haue beene caried away madneſſe murmure reſt people yet notwithſtanding vſeth preface lorde knowe thou art rightuous truely would fayne enter diſputation thee prouoked thereto fleſhly deſire bycauſe ſee thinges ſo farre order woulde fayne inquire cauſe thou workeſt ſuch ſort tempted therevnto howbeit lorde take leaue aske thou dealeſt thus proteſt firſt thou art rightuous vnpartiall nothing come frō thee worthy praiſe thus ye ſee manner proceeding whiche wee ought hold ſo often wee haue deale god incomprehenſible iudgementes conſider oure wit able mount ſo highe bee deepe dungeon v go downe let v practiſe thing cheefely ſelues inaſmuche men full hypocriſie alwayes beleeue themſelues bee cleare guiltleſſe god although bee fully perſwaded yet beare themſelues hand god hath cauſe purſue thē ſo great rigoure euery man flattereth himſelfe leſſen owne ſinnes although bee fully conuicted vvell ſayeth hee true ſinner yet worſt ſorte worlde know greatneſſe ſinnes bycauſe tie ſcarfes afore oure eye foraſmuche wee puffed vp pryde ſtandeth v hand practize leſſon ſpecially god afflicteth v namely enter quarelling althoughe hys chaſtizementes ſeeme ouerrough v acknowledge meaſurableneſſe doings hee exceſsiue ende ſame may teache v frame ourſelues quietly vntoo whenſoeuer god chaſtizing v reſpect ſinnes let v aſſure ourſelues ſame ſingular grace ſpeciall priuiledge hee giueth vnto v alwayes iuſt cauſe puniſhe v althoughe rightuouſeſt perſons world nowe farre ſuch perfection vvhat might god doo vntoo v neuertheleſſe hee viſite v trie pacience graunt v grace ſuffer name ſake myght puniſhe v ſinnes let v vnderſtand hee doth v excellent great honour therefore let v humble ſelues euery one v owne behalfe haue modeſtie ſay well would fayne god ſhould vſe another faſhion ſeeming hee paſſeth meaſure afflicting mee yet know hee doth without cauſe ſith afflicting mee ſinnes ſo muche fauour ſheweth mee haue deſerued much therefore behoueth ſtoupe ſubmit ſelfe wholy good wyll ye ſee meane whereby god may glorifyed v yeelde vntoo hym rightuouſneſſe keeping mouthes ſhutte according sainct paule treateth thereof third romaynes ſaying ende mouthes myght ſtopped worlde acknowledge ſelfe bee indetted vntoo god hee onely ſhoulde iuſtified ſort god ſhall bee iuſtified v according sainct paule witte v condemne oure ſelues haue boldeneſſe ſtyrre againſte god willingly confeſſe v indaungered vnto hym wee bee come point god iuſtifyed ſaye hys rightuouſneſſe commended v wyth ſuche prayſe hee deſerueth contrarywiſe men exalt themſelues knowledge bee indaungered vntoo god ſo hee may condemne confeſſe bonde dette whyche haue forfeyted vntoo hym althoughe proteſt minde iuſtifie ſay confeſſe hym bee rightuous yet neuertheleſſe condemne furthermore whereas ſayde eliu ſo angrie let v marke great differen 〈…〉 betweene anger proceedeth godly zeale 〈…〉 anger v moued withall either h 〈…〉 goodes honour reſpect ow 〈…〉 hee angrie diſpleaſed priuat paſsion wiſe excuſed although hee al 〈…〉 ledge good cauſe yet notwithſtanding h 〈…〉 offendeth god beeing angrie wee bee blin 〈…〉 oure owne paſsions therefore marke 〈…〉 poynte behoueth v bridle anger ſpecially wee prouoked bee angrie neyghbours reſpect ſelues howbeeit one anger whiche good namely whiche proceedeth greefe wee conceyue god offended inflamed good zeale mainteyne god quarell bee angrie blame let v marke ſuch anger muſte bee without reſpecting perſones man bee angrie paſsion fleſhe ſuche one hath reſpect hymſelfe intendeth maynteyne himſelfe agayne hee intende ſhewe hee beareth fauour hys freendes doth men accepting perſons bycauſe haue regarde ourſelues vvee ſhould rather bee angrie ſelues wee woulde god ſhoulde allowe oure anger wrath thys thing whyche sainct paule ſpeaketh hee alledgeth purpoſely whiche ſayde pſalme concerning oure beeing angrie howbeeit withoute offending howe done man entereth intoo owne conſcience ſearcheth himſelfe earneſtly hath eye vnto others ſo muche himſelfe condemne hymſelfe fighte againſte owne paſsions yee ſee ſort wee may bee angrie point muſt beginne oure anger haue allowed god witte euery man muſt beginne himſelfe bee angrie hys owne ſinnes vice caſt vp choler ſee wee haue prouoked god wrath againſte v full ſo muche wretchedneſſe let v bee angri • greeued let poynte v beginne afterwarde lette v condemne euill whereſoeuer bee founde well oureſelues freendes let v bee ledde priuate hatred caſt rage vppon man bycauſe wee bee fore poſſeſſed ſome euill affection thys manner ſhall anger allowable ſhall ſhewe ſame proceedeth true zeale godwarde true wee ſhall alwayes bee able keepe meaſure although godly zeale reigne v yet ſhoulde ſtill doo amiſſe exceeding meaſure god reſtreyned v therefore zealouſneſſe behoueth v haue diſcretion ſtay ſelues yet neuertheleſſe haue ſayde alreadye anger ſhall bee allowable ſpring ſayd fountaine ſay hate euill whereſoeuer fynde euen thoughe bee oure owne perſons nowe thyng wee haue marke thys ſtreyne firſt formoſt wee muſte condemne anger ſee man chafed choler muſt always take vice ſee theſe ſcorners god ſay oh ſtorme ſo meete ſhould angrie might vſe quieter faſhion blaſpheme deſpiſe god wickedly according many bee ſeene whiche could find hart ouerthrow al doctrine ſeeking nothing elſe ſpread ſuche corruption abroade men might knowe god truthe might buried whē haue ſo done would haue men winke rather allowe theyr doings tell nothing fable pulpit ſo ſhould rebuking well matter ſay preach withoute beeing angrie poſsible ſhoulde ſee mortall tranſitorie creature lift vp himſelfe faſhion againſt god trample good doctrine vnder feete yet notwithſtanding beare paciently vvee ſhould ſhewe thereby zeale god v ſayde pſalme zeale god houſe ought eate v vp wee worme gnawing vpon hart ought greeue v ſo much reproche done vntoo god wee ſee truth turned lye let v learne winke vice let v diſcerne betweene godly zeale fleſhly anger wherewith men moued inflamed theyr owne quarells according ſay de heere eliu kindled diſpleaſure whote anger yet notwithſtanding reckened hym vertue holy ghoſte whyche ſpeaketh ſay let v conſider heereby muſt firſt daſh reiect anger haue eye cauſe man diſpleaſed greeueth god offended truth peruerted let v conſider anger ſpringeth good fountayne furthermore according whiche haue ſayd let v learne vtter choler ſee god honour wounded men go darken deface truth let v bee moued inflamed may ſhew ſelues child god cannot giue better proofe neuertheleſſe let v heerewithall keepe ſuch meaſure wee mingle oure owne exceſsiue paſsions zeale god bee diſcreete putting differēce betweene againe although hate abhorre vice yet notwithſtanding let v labour bring perſons ſaluation truely practiſing heere hard howbeit god guide v ſo ſuffer ſelues ledde holy ſpirite gyue whole gouernment v meane behoueth v marke well doctrine bycauſe theſe dayes wee ſee infinite occaſions angrie wee bee child god one ſyde papiſtes whiche ſeeke nothing aboliſhe religion true pretende mainteine chriſtianitie whatſoeuer ſay intend nothing elſe ſuppreſſe maieſtie god vvee ſee howe god truth torne peeces curſed blaſphemies ſpued outby pray theſe thing ſhoulde touche v quicke wounded man ſhoulde ſtrike v dagger wee thereby ſhewe wee knowe god woorthy taken child vve bee ſo chare owne honeſtie wounded meanes indure meane god honour ſhall put ſhame reproche wee make countenance muſt god needes ſhake v ſhewe haue affection mainteyne honour marke one poynt howbeeit neede go ſo farre papiſts euen among ſelues wee ſee theſe dog swine ſeeke nothing defyle thing thruſt groyne god word labour ouerturne wee ſee theſe mocker god theſe heatheniſh villaynes whiche turne thing ſcorne mockerie wee ſee wicked men turken corrupt marre thing falſe ſlaunders ſee heretikes ſowe theyr poyſon abroade deſtroy thing pray ſee theſe thing ought wee moued ſayd men bend themſelues againſt god manner one would wound deathe ſhall ſee ſayth scripture whome haue perced god telleth v men ſo come ſtrike dagger ſhall meane paſſe god telleth v ſpirite greeued ſort payne ſhall wee laugh againe heare ſuch horrible blaſphemies name lord ieſus chriſt torne peeces talke adayes ſcorning reproching god name ſuch wiſe man might bee aſhamed heare among turkes vve ſee naughtipackes committe one ſyde whoredome diſorders ſyde outrage violence bee ſhorte wee ſee thing vtterly ſquare doo wee ſhewe oureſelues bee god child chriſtians wee make accounte vvhat proofe doo wee giue oure chriſtendome muche behoueth v haue another maner zeale haue heeretofore v angrie let bee ſinnes ſpecially wee ſee god greeuouſly offended ſhall wee haue anger allowed god lyke ſpoken heere holy ghoſt prayſeth yet notwithſtanding foraſmuche eaſye v ſwarue aſide let v therwithall beware giue bridle paſsions let v pray god ſo gouerne v holy ſpirit zeale may altogither pure end may allowed nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may ſigh ſobbe whereas haue bene ouermuche hardned heretofore ſoothing ſelues vice ſo coulde greued ſee worlde ſo farre order may learne hereafter ſorie oure euill doings deſire forgiueneſſe intent may ſo guyde v reſt life holy ſpirite may ſeeke altogither ſerue honour al poynts according calling ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father c cxx sermon ſecond vpon xxxij chapter 4 eliu vvayted till iob made end vvords cauſe vvere elder 5 vvhen eliu ſavv thoſe three men haue reaſon vvas moued anger 6 therefore eliu ſonne barachell buzite aunſvvered ſayde yonger yeares auncient therefore doubted vvas afrayde put forth myne opinion 7 thought vvith ſelfe yeares ſhall ſpeake length time ſhall bring foorth vviſedome 8 ſpirit god vvhich men inſpiration almightie gyueth vnderſtanding 9 great men ſhall vviſe therefore neyther ſhall aged haue iudgement 10 therefore ſay heare alſo vvill ſhevv doctrine yeſterday treated zeale eliu whiche prayſed v heere holye ghoſte ſhewed wherevntoo example ought ſerue v namelye ſee god truthe defaced hys name blaſphemed ſame oughte wound heart alſo ſhewed wee haue affectiō god honour muſt mainteine truth vttermoſt power true euery man ſhall haue learning yet neuertheleſſe according abilitie meaſure behoueth v ſhew mind reſiſt euil conſent vnto withall declared zeale ought guided reaſon ſo wee muſte moued ouergreat headineſſe muſt haue ſome good reſpect matched thyng red euen namely eliu ouerhaſtie giuen eare ſayings beene alledged afore therein ſhewed modeſtie let v marke well man thruſt himſelfe foorth raſhly without conſidering whether needefull hym ſpeake ſhall bee reckened vnto zealouſneſſe example ſee many thinke long till may haue libertie ſpeake yet notwithſtanding poſsible ſome ſhall much better able lay foorth matter yet owne ſeeming ſhall neuer ſpeake ſoone ynough haſtineſſe neuer allowable proofe thereof knoweth ſpeaketh inſtruct others whether ſome men bee better able hee himſelfe neede taught thruſteth foorth himſelfe teacher yet fault ignorant perſone ſuch one well groūded babbleth ſtoppeth mouthes ſuch haue grace better meanes edifie withall therefore let v marke well modeſtie zeale raſh gouerned ſpirit god god ſpirit doth deede deale abroade gracious gift contrary himſelfe seeing named ſpirit diſcretiō meete v diſcerne needefull ſpeake keepe ſilence true man may wel put foorth ſome good matter although moſt ability inferior others howbeit behoueth deale fearefully ſhew commeth adeſire readineſſe take profite hee leuer bee learner teacher man go ſo worke although hee ſpeake multitude yet hee fayle modeſt lowly man fyle ſpeach make ende talke determine vppon thing therein ſheweth ſome vaingloriouſneſſe moreouer giueth roome god grace ought thus ye ſee ſhewed v example eliu ſayd wayted till word end hee knewe yet wherevnto matter would come heerevntoo addeth bare reuerēce vnto age ſaw iob thoſe talked auncient men foraſmuch age bringeth experience grauite eliu thruſteth himſelfe foorth knowing god ſuffereth manne liue long tyme worlde hee gyueth hym grace bee able profite ſuche yonger hee hath liued longer therefore ought alſo better ſettled haue gotten ſome skill ſo thing wee haue marke ſeconde place eliu acknowledged thoſe ſpoken afore auncients heere yong men haue good profitable leſſon put well vre haue ſayd already man hath liued long hee ought haue remembred thing god hath ſhewed experiēce thoſe ought ſerue himſelfe alſo giue good counſell others haue like experience alſo grauitie matched yong men ought thynke although god hath giuen ſome vnderſtanding yet want muche bycauſe haue ſeene much man want experience ſurely ſhall time time raſhly ouerſhoote himſelfe hee forecaſteth end thing neither knoweth begin moreouer heate yong men alwayes contrarie reaſon good vnderſtanding though yong man bee well ſtayed alſo haue good knowledge therewithall yet notwithſtanding youth driueth hym headlong ſuche boyling hys nature hee cannot alwayes rule hymſelfe vve ſee howe saint paule warneth timothie ſhould bee ſubiecte luſtes youth theſe luſtes youthe hee meeneth diſorderedneſſe playing whorehunting drunkenneſſe ſuche looce behauiour timothie myrrour patterne holineſſe himſelfe yea saint paule faine exhort drinking wine yet notwithſtanding ſpeaketh luſts youth muche hee yong yeares poſsible bee ouerhaſtie diuers thinges nowe behoued timothie paſſed elder diſcretion grauitie receyue warning common ſort neede therefore let yong folk looke well ſelues haue honeſtie hearken elder learne followe counſell ſurely vertues world one vice would ſtaine defile ther common vice preſumption much yong men haue beene acquainted difficulty manye thing therefore ſteppe forth boldely ſticke thing nothing thinke vnpoſsible vnto youth doth alwayes carrie preſumption ouercommon ordinarie inconuenience yet therefore borne withall ſayde yong man haue many vertues beſydes yet truſt himſelfe yea deſpize auncientes beare ſelfe hande hee able leade others god confounde pryde giftes ſhall bee defaced therefore ſo muche ought yong folkes ſuche haue yet ſeene muche bridle ſelues yea much wee ſee nowe adayes worlde ſo farre order yong folkes haue gathered ſuche diueliſh pryde bee paſt receyuing maner nurture inſtruction suche haue feare god ought fight ſo muche againſte ſelues end caried away common faſhion vve ſhall ſee theſe yong royſters take vpon men ſone bee vnder rodde notwithſtanding yet worthy beare name child yong cockchickins three dayes hatching yet needes bee great men ought bee kept yet halfe ſcore yeares vnder rodde beholde bee owne ſeeming fully men wherein malapartneſſe ſhameleſſe harlotte stewes may good willes vnder awe correction al world ſeeth ſeeing vice common contageous diſeaſe thoſe whome god hath giuen grace ought bethinke ſelues well take heed intangled ſhoulde bee caryed awaye others god hilde ſtrong hand let god child ſtande vpon garde aſſure ſelues bee modeſt verie much although haue ſo gay ſhewe albeit deſirous ſet forth ſelues deſpiſe bycauſe go perking vp nebbes let aſſure ſelues much allowed god bliſſe honeſt behauiour make profit two yeres thā thoſe ouerhaſt efellowes ſhall foure vvee ſee hapneth vnto fruites fruite bee ſoone ripe come ſoone perfect colour doth alſo fade away incontinently fruite latewarde longer continuance euen ſo ſuch put forth ſelues time truely may beare goodly ſhewe haue ſome taſte ſhall haue ſubſtancialneſle contrariwiſe ſhamefaſt honeſt preſumptuous put forth ſelues haſtily ſurely ſlowe yet meane ſeaſon oure lorde giueth fruite longer continuance thus yee ſee good point beare away ſentence true modeſtie vertue conuenient menne yet ought yong folkes marke ſayde heere namely muſt yeelde honor elder acknowledging owne part may haue exceſsiue paſsions neede reſtrained mē ſufficiently ſtayde owne nature againe haue experience bee ſo skilfull requiſite furthermore yong man hath behaued himſelf ſo modeſtly muſt time conuenient viter thing god hath giuen yea euē though among olde men order nature letteth olde men diſcharge duty yong men may ſupply roome behalfe yea euen ehe ſhame thoſe haue liued long miſpent time god hath giuē rather vtterly loſt ye ſee meane haue hold reuerence yong folk beare elder muſt hinder continuall maintenance truth god ſhuld honored vice ſuppreſſed may com paſſe elder ſort ſhall deſtitute god ſpirit elſe leud perſons ſhall haue nothing craft vnfaythfulneſſe elſe ſhal wilfull braineleſſe ſuch caces ought yong folkes bee hilde ſo vnder yoke ſhould authoritie elder turned away god word thing good holie let v marke modeſtie importeth yong men ſhoulde become ſheepiſhe diſcerne know nothing ynough preſume thēſelues skirmiſh caſt froth time let hearken let teachable let bee alwayes willing keepe ſilence good matter debating ſpecially let beware ſtepping men place beeing done ſee elder ſort ſhew good example ſpecially peruert good turning euill ſaid mete god ſpirit ſhuld ſhewe ſelfe like oure time haue bin miſled ſuperſtitions poperie longer haue liued worlde haue ſtill leſſer knowledge nowe tarie till god ſhoulde ſerue turne meane commonly needefull theſe aged men haue long experience haue beene plunged darkeneſſe ther knowledge god pureneſſe religion vvhat could ſuch aged men bring onely greater wilfulneſſe haue beene ſo ſaped errours ſo wholly giuen vnto likelyhoode meanes bring nowe god liſt call yong men publiſh worde abroade reaſon holie ghoſte ſhould bee ſo brydeled yong men might ſpeake olde men contented heare true like god calleth ſome ſorts ſo hath commonly beene bee ſerued elder ſorte neuertheleſſe hee hath declared alſo truth tyed vnto age wee ſee nowe modeſtie ought bee men generally ſpecially yong men witte muſt yeelde ſelues quietly learne ſo farre occaſion ſhall bee giuen deſire vaunte ſelues bee led fonde longing make ſhew receyue thing ſilence ſhall alledged others make ſo much owne paynted ſheath acknowledge haue neede bee guyded gouerned thoſe experience doone wee ſhall neede bee reſtreyned iudging vnder ſhadow elderſhippe goe lyke ſillie beaſtes holde thing come mouth word god bycauſe ſay muſte bee ſo diſcretion ought matched zeale according haue declared alreadie ſpirit god conteyneth bee modeſtie men muſt alſo zeale diſcretion wee muſt onely bee brideled authoritie ſuche haue liued long alſo whole world brought againſt v yet oughte antiquitie preiudice thing rightfull neceſſarie howe haue tolde alreadie al old men popedome conſpired againſt goſpell would haue men ſtande accuſtomed faſhion ment ancientneſſe ſhuld ſhet god word dores yong men ſhoulde bee letted maynteine truth although olde men ſet themſelues againſt would haue men holde themſelues cuſtomes bycauſe haue mainteyned euil long time thoſe whome god hath giuen better grace ought ſteppe vp againſt howebeit behooueth v paſſe man ſay vnto v howe nowe aboue hundred yeares ago ſince oure father forefather haue lyued ſorte fiue hundred yeares yea thouſand yeares ago ſince theſe thing haue beene obſerued ſince menne haue hilde lawe infallible rule ſay men alledge antiquitie time yea man ſhoulde alledge creation world yet muſt god truth bee oppreſſed vnder ſhadowe wee ſee nowe bee modeſt behoueth v blynde buſſardes keepe meane meaſure whiche eliu meeneth adding ſayde age ſhall ſpeake multitude yeares ſhall vtter knowledge ſpirite god owelleth men inspiration almightie giueth vnderſtanding marke howe order nature goeth afore witte muſt giue care elder men chooſe gouernours citie countrey ſhoulde take yong light headed braineleſſe fooles haue skill gouerne owne perſons choſing ſuch iudges leader peruerting order nature yea ſhame might ſeem men intended ſpite god often ſo men might chooſe ſettled perſonages men great grauitie ripeneſſe would let ſit ſtil houſes meane take phantaſticall fellowes little snales one nightes growth ſet ſeate iuſtice knowe meeneth like men ſhould marrie little babe would pleaſe well married bycauſe would ſayde vnto ſhall eate roſt meate paſtycruſt would like verie well therefore mariage euen ſo ſay thoſe ſette ſeate iuſtice haue neyther skill witte worſſe babe bycauſe men conſideration choſe ſuche grauitie experience therefore behoueth order nature bee obſerued firſte whiche wee haue men yeares whome god hath indued grace ſhould put office guide others yonger ſort humble themſelues vnder ſhame yong men ſhould take vpon roome elder diſdayne receyue inſtruction handes thoſe haue liued long pryde bindeth ſelfe againſte mortall men reſiſting god hath ſettled order nature would haue men obſerue much ſayde v preacher ſtate bearing abroade publiſhing god word well tryed man good experience knowledge men vouchſafe bee ſerued ſuch one take yong man auenture thing therefore behoueth v haue ſame order eſtimation neuertheleſſe muſt generall rule made oftentimes may come paſſe god ſhall giue much grace yong men ſuche haue lyued double time therefore ſayde order wee haue ſpoken muſt hinder ſpirite god hee ſhould bee receyued hee ſheweth ſelfe giftes bee applyed good vſe according hee diſtributeth cauſe saint paule choſe timothie though many elder men time hee ſeene excellent man recorde onely men alſo holie ghoſt preferred thoſe elder euen ſo dealeth eliu heere hearkened vnto others ſayth hee knewe ſpirite god men hee ſhould ſay true muſt iudge olde men doe dote excepte wee knowe howe matter goeth neyther muſte wee fayle giue roome place muſt yeelde ſuch honour age ſay well man hath ſeene much able teache v perceiue diſcharge dutie hath loſt time hath liued world ſpirit god yong man behoueth put forth ſelfe let v mark wel obſeruing order nature muſt alwayes ſuch condition god indueth giftes grace ſhoulde ſerue church ſhould teach onely equal companion alſo euen oldeſt mē conſequently rich men muſt ſticke age therevpon vnpacient reiect warning ſay howe nowe haue liued long time ſhall yong ▪ladde teach leſſon let thinke thu • ſelues ought haue profited ſuche wi • e might haue beene leader others ſee ne • haue need bee led ſelfe yong chylde compariſon thoſe ſhoulde haue beene taught mee ſeeing ſo god hathe diſappoynted mee grace requiſite leader behoueth mee bee ſcholler mayſter yee ſee olde men ought yeelde themſelues conformitie ſee god hath gyuen larger giftes grace thoſe oughte followe goe afore nowe haue wee good doctrine put vre whiche wee gather thinges ſette downe heeretofore whiche better conceyuing thing conteyned let v marke eliu ſaying ſpirit god whiche dwelleth men ment expreſſe pleaſeth god one man ſhall bee greater vnderſtanding another ſpeciall gifte granteth priuiledge true generally god hath made v reaſonable creature thing wherein wee differ brute beaſtes god hath gyuen ſome diſcretion vnderſtanding men withoute exception yet notwithſtanding wee ſee ſome ſlowe dull otherſome quicke witted ſome phantaſticall otherſome good grauitie vvhereof commeth let v vnderſtande god holdeth giftes hande dealeth pleaſure whome hee thinketh good eliphas mente expreſſe place ende men ſhould thinke ſelues haue naturall inheritaunce mother wombe thing belonging dutie gotten owne purchaſe beholde eliu telleth v god hath created v true wee haue ſome reaſon howebeit meaſure yet notwithſtanding man haue knowledge wiſdome behooueth knowe god hath reached oute hande vnto peculiarly therefore hee beholden bounde vntoo ſayde vnto v intente wee ſhoulde bee exalted pryde thinke oure ſelues bee worth bycauſe wee haue knowledge vnderſtanding wee ſhoulde conſider muche hath pleaſed god giue v grace behoueth v walke ſo muche greater feare wee ſo much dette therewithall giuing benefites ende wee ſhoulde communicate neyghbours therefore vſe glorifying oure god edifying ſuche haue neede cortaine wee ſo muche blame worthy wee haue marke one poynt behoueth v alſo make compariſon heere betweene two degree wit bee god giueth ſpeciall vnderſtanding vnto men diſcerne thing pertaine tranſitorie life bee ſaide doctrine goſpell true pure religion haue wee thoſe nature wee purchaſe thoſe owne trauell ala wee muſt needes come farre ſhorte fall man bee good ſchoole maiſter teach chyldren good aduocate phiſition good marchant citie good laborer countrey continually ſpirite god worketh theſe thing man ſhall haue neede bee ſharpe witted ſome one thing ſome like required greater skill ſome handycraftes marchandize nowe euen theſe thing ſeeme bee common value themſelues god muſt bee fayne diſtribute holie ſpirit vnto men wee come doctrine goſpell wiſedome ſurmounteth man vnderſtanding yea woonderfull euen verie angelles bee verie ſecretes heauen whiche conteyned goſpell concerneth knowing god perſon ſonne although oure lorde ieſus chriſte came downe heere beneath yet muſte wee comprehende godlie maieſtie elſe wee grounde ſeetle oure fayth ſay concerneth knowledge thinges incomprehenſible man nature nowe god muſt bee faine deale ſpirite reſpecte handicraftes worldly trade concerne tranſitorie life muche ought wee thinke oure owne ſharpe witte able knowe thing concerne god ſecretes kingdome behoueth v bee taught meane ſeaſon become fooles reſpecte ſelues saincte paule ſayeth wee may bee partaker wiſedome ſentence giuen thereof namely naturall man doeth neuer comprehende doctrine god ſay long men abyde owne naturall kynde neyther knowe god time taſte worde worſe follie sainct paule ſayth ſeeming vnreaſonable doctrine therefore ſpirite god gyueth v fayth inlightneth v ought bee well marked wee ſee ſo fewe know god yea many men whiche well ſtricken yeares haue liued long time worlde ſtarke madde superſtitions fight feercely againſt doctrine goſpel oftentimes dazeleth eye amazed yea heere texte ought arme v againſt ſuch ſtumbling blockes ſpirite god dwelleth men inſpiration almightie giueth vnderſtanding ſee wretched men blinded ſo plunged ignorance cannot come goſpel let v maruell man naturall kind diſcerne whit god ſecrets vntill wee inlightned contrariwiſe wee ſee man knoweth god whether yong old ſee olde man hath bin ſaped long dotage papiſtrie come right religion let v aſſure ſelues god hath wrought miracle cace alſo wee ſee yong folkes come let v aſſure ourſelues god draweth maruellous faſhion eaſily receyue yoke bycauſe bee full preſumption ſayd afore god tame make teachable mightie hand hath brought thē vnto ſo ſe text ought ſerue v two thing firſt ſeeing wit neuer reach ſo highe knowe god truth ought put owne reaſon v renounce vtterly thing whiche saincte paule termeth bee made foole haue lorde fill v wiſedome behoueth v become fooles ſay wee muſte bring anye thing weene ſelues haue one thing ſhetting doore againſte god vvherefore wee haue god continue grace holie ſpirite ſhall haue giuen v portion wee muſt learne exalt magnifie deſerueth acknowledge one drop good vnderſtanding v till god haue put v agayne ſame muſt cauſe v perſiſt alwayes obedience walke greate feare carefulneſſe ſeeing god ſhould quenche light hath put v wee ſhould bee darkneſſe yea ſo horrible darkeneſſe wee could neuer get firſte vſe place ſeconde although wee ſee greater part worlde goe aſtraye ſcarcely man willing ſubmitte himſelfe vnto god muſt thinke ſtraunge men ſhoulde bee ſo farre order playe wylde beaſtes ſpirite god gyueth vnderſtanding vvherefore let ſame bee ground v magnifie god grace ſhall haue receyued therewithall let v bee caryed awaye thoughe wee ſee ſuche rebelliouſneſſe men followe owne kynde followe owne heade meane reſiſt god bycauſe doctrine goſpell ſurmounteth man reaſon god muſt bee fayne worke holie ſpirite opening eye elſe ſhall abyde continually beaſtlyneſſe finally eliu concludeth therevpon great men alwayes wiſe ſometimes aged menne haue vnderstanding skill diſcretion men truely eliu meeneth heere peruert order nature hee hathe proteſted heeretofore hee woulde hearken aged willyng ſubmitte himſelfe theyr doctrine meeneth haue touched alredie namely god bounde age ſtates quality men vvhen pleaſeth god aduaunce man dignitie hee haue ſerue welfare people hee indueth grace able diſcharge office otherwiſe leueth deſtitute higher mā degree ſhall hee bee knowne bee double beaſt example bee man choſen preach god worde god bee mynded ſhewe fauoure churche hee indue ſayde man ſpirite hee gyue vnderſtanding worde hee graunt cunning skill apply vſe people gather good doctrine finally hee gyue zealouſneſſe thing requiſite hee ſhewe ſelfe ſo manifeſtly behalfe wee may ſay hee hath care v hee diſtributeth grace ſorte vnto menne thing requiſite welfare muche ſaye ſitte ſeate iuſtice according haue neede ſpirite god ſhoulde bee doubled ſo alſo god intendeth bee ſerued hee giueth mightie power diſcharge dutie contrariwiſe god bee •• g • ie v ſhal haue preaching word ſhall bee beaſtes withoute vnderſtanding men ſhall deſpiſe diſguyſing thinges ſo good doctrine ſhall bee defaced defyled bee ſhorte ſcarſely ſhall bee good ſchollers therefore muche leſſe good mayſters yee ſee eliu ment ſhewe ſaying great men ſhall •• always bee wyze aged men alwayes men best vnderſtanding hee ſhoulde ſay wee muſte make generall rule ſay man aduaunced hie eſtate authoritie therefore hee muſte needes bee man knowledge wee muſte gather ſuche conſequent god well forſake great one ſo ſhall become groſſe beaſts longer ſhall haue liued ſhall haue miſpent breade beeing fed god coſt ſo muche beene better woulde ſay oxe beene fed beene better beſtowed let v learne muche god diſtributeth hys ſpirite thoſe whome hee intendeth apply ſeruice ought ſo muche better imploye themſelues carefully feare god doe otherwiſe appeare thoſe taken bee wyſeſt ſhall bee vtterly blinded ſo ſhall know god according god threatneth prophet eſay ſaying aged ſhall ſee whit wiſe ſhal become brutiſh vtterly dul vve ſee thē howe god declareth muche horrible vengeance againſte great men olde men gouernoures againſte common people heereby wee bee warned wee muſte attribute infallible authoritie though coulde neuer errenor miſgouerne others nowe god doe blinde olde men greate men ſuche authoritie ſorte ſhall become pray god giue holie ſpirite let v marke well cauſe god maketh threatning mennes hypocriſie bycauſe ſerued countenaunce ſake hearte farre ſo proteſted ſerue mouth meane gaue ſelues tradition menne ſaye god raigned alone ouer worde men owne ſcope god abide authoritie ſhould bee ſo diminiſhed cauſe hee ſayth binde wiſe take away vnderſtanding reaſon aged vvherefore wee deſire haue god gouerne v reigne among v inioye gracious giftes neceſſarie ſaluation let v learne behoueth v yeelde dominion ſoueraintie ouer v v great ſmall muſt ftame ſelues obedience furthermore let v take worde rule ſuffer ſelues bee gouerned aſſuring oure ſelues otherwiſe wee muſte looke holie ghoſt ſhall worke v therefore let v ſeeke meanes taught god woulde ſhould ſhepeherdes church preach word wee ſhoulde receyue correction warning ſhould ſhepeheards church preach word wee ſhoulde receyue correction warning handes done ſo throughly ought bee let v praye god ſupplie defaulte vvherefore let v walke ſuche humilitie oure whole deſire may god ſhould haue preheminence ouer v aſſuring oure ſelues wee haue reaſon vnderſtanding wee bee inlightned holie ſpirite meane whereby hee neuer ſuffer v bee thruſt way hee hathe begun guide teach v make v grow ſtronger wiſedome according sainte paule ſayth ſeeing god hath begon v ſuffer v want thing vntill latter day whiche time wee ſhall haue full knowledge thing whiche wee knowe nowe part let v fall face good god acknowledgement oure ſinnes praying make v ſo perceiue thē may vtterly beaten downe ſpecially knowing number wantes miſeries bee v may pray reforme v clenſe v ſpots make v ſo pure holie ſpirite hee maye alwayes acknowledge auowe v bee child wee alſo ſide may ſerue honour father ſhewe ſuch brotherly loue one towardes another commaundeth ſo may ſeeke nothing exalt holy name among v euery v degree yeelde due honour may pleaſe graunt grace c cxxj sermon third vpon xxxij chapter 11 beholde haue vvayted vvordes giuing eare vvhile prepared youre ſelues ſought reaſons 12 conſidered vvas none diſproued iob anſvvered vvordes 13 ende maye ſay vvee haue founde vviſdome god hath caſt man 14 hee hath directed vvoordes vnto mee neyther anſvvere according vvoordes 15 vvere afrayde anſvvered left ſpeaking 16 taryed ſpake ſtoode ſtill anſvvered 17 alſo anſvvere turne ſhevve mine aduice 18 full matter ſpirite belly conſtreyneth mee 19 beholde bellie vvyne hathe vente nevve barrelles burſt 20 therefore vvill ſpeake haue vent vvill open lippes anſvvere 21 vvill novve accept perſon man neyther vvill giue title man 22 ſhoulde flatter tell vvhether maker vvoulde deſtroye mee incontinently like declared yeſterday man ought put forth himſelfe haſtily ſhoulde rather ſeeke learne teach others except neceſsitie cōſtrayned v ſhewed v heere wee muſt thruſt ſelues vnknown matter knowe well howe caſe ſtandeth truely wee ſee ſuch diſputing matter wel knowne runne aſtray ſpeake vnto wardly therein perceiue owne want therefore haue marke ſhewed v heere example eliu namely muſt caſt forth wordes auenture bee ouerhaſtie giuing ſentence thing hidden v whereof wee duely informed true leſſon perteyneth cheefly ſuche ſet ſeate iuſtice ought examine matter throughly iudge neuertheleſſe euerie man ought obſerue ſame rule owne behalfe firſt wee haue marke heere according declared yeſterday alwayes ſee ſayd namely whē god ſpirit gouerneth man like giueth zeale moueth religion ſo alſo giueth skill diſcretion ſo one goeth neuer without man haue vnruly zeale bee counted anye vertue god ſpirite raigne ſhall perceiue thoſe thing inſeparable ſo much ought wee praye god giue v grace mainteine truth alſo ſhewe v time ſpeake hold peace giue v vnderſtanding reaſon runne rouers vnaduiſedneſſe ſlender excuſe ſay thought done well tooke matter bee ſo true man ſometimes ouerſeen therefore ſo much ought take heede ourſelues conſidering weakeneſſe owne wit ſeeke bee gouerned god hande ſo hauing good zeale wee may alſo haue reaſon weeld rule well nowe let v come eliu ſaith declareth diſcours ſhall ſuch men say ſaith haue haue founde wiſdome god hath ouerthrowne iob men eliu betokeneth take another way diſputing againſte iob men done way hild thou art afflicted hande god ſay without cauſe therefore muſt concluded thou arte wicked man thine affliction ſo great vnmeaſurable neuer yet man worlde ſeene ſo ſore preſſed thou therefore followeth thou paſſeſt al men wickedneſſe lo foū dation iobs freends toke going reproue eliu proteſteth take way ſurely apparant gone forward ſorte ſtill made matter worſe worſe haue told iob able maintein ſoundneſſe walked feare god offended thing ſauing could ſettle mind wholy obeying god thought affliction ſtrange howbeit reſpect principall point cace good iuſt surely ſome mē vnderſtand text though eliu ſhould ſay thinke ye ſhall become wiſe holding peace god confound wel inough though mortal men meddle man loke neerely matter hee ſhall finde naturall ſenſe bee haue ſpoken namely eliu taunteth iobs freendes vpbraydeth expreſly thought themſelues haue founde wiſdome like commonly ſay prouerbe man thinketh hath founde beane cake ther ſome ſubtile mening thing windeth himſelf ſome companie put forth opinion deuice bearing himſelfe hande hath inuincible reſon althogh fond trifling ſpeaketh eliu ſemeth ſaith knot matter much god hath preſſed iob ſort puniſhed ſo roughly therfore hee enemie take bee ſo good ſtrong foūdation nothing worth according haue declared already although god viſit man doth therefore folow wicked albeit god threaten tranſgreſſours law puniſh perſons good child yet iob perſecuted reſpect another cauſe although god thretned trāſgreſſors ment reſerueth libertie himſelf exerciſe pacience faithful whē liſteth may ſhew himſelf rough towards thē although haue reſpect vnto offē ce haue cōmitted vvherfore humble reaſon ought well ſuffice beſide god haue ſeruants example vnto others moreouer needfull mortifie fleſhly affection oftentimes haue ſecret vice v god remedieth beforehand ſomtimes ſendeth v affliction wee knowe cauſe hee ſeeth farre cleerer wee muſt fully conclude god ſcourgeth good ſuche haue prouoked wrath hee ceaſſeth ſhewe himſelfe roughe towardes execute greate rygoure vpon ſo muche ſhall ſeeme hee mynded ouerwhelme vtterly therefore ſayd men ſhoulde count wicked fonde argument although iobs freends ground themſelues vpon thought haue founde wiſdome behalfe yet notwithſtanding ſay childiſh thing vvherefore concerning texte let v beare thing mynde haue touched heeretofore behaue oure ſelues diſcretely god afflicteth men iudge auenture hee whiche beaten god rod forthwith cōdemned ſinnes meaſured affliction raſhe vnwiſe proceeding make generall rule howe let v vnderſtande god hath diuers reaſons afflicte menne true ordinarie iuſtice puniſhe ſinnes neuertheleſſe ſometimes trie obedience good men ſuche haue ſerued applyed whole indeuer followe commaundementes yea thoſe ſhall handled greater rigoure wicked god intendeth teache bee humble obedient seeing cace ſtandeth ſo behoueth v refraine haſtie iudgement man afflicted god alſo preſerue ſeruantes temptation hee ſendeth true haue meanes prouoked diſpleaſure hee remedieth euill afflicting nowe ſhall wee therevpon iudge ſuche handled roughlieſt wickedeſt vvhat thing see yee wee ſhould proceede cleane backwarde god quite contrarie intente purpoſe furthermore let v applye well oure neighbour oureſelues wee ſee men afflicted many miſeries let v firſte looke vnto life bee haſtie giue ſentence vpon conſider howe haue liued deſpizer god vnruly perſon man giuen outrageous vice bee greeuouſly puniſhed let v acknowledge therein god ſheweth v picture hys vengeance haue iuſt occaſion iudge ſo thing ſelfe ſpeaketh vvhen man hathe deſpized god ſpente whole life diſorderly ſee god ſcourgeth behalf doubting matter ſelfe darke difficulte oure iudgement ſhall bee ouerhaſtie wee proceede ſorte contrariwiſe wee haue ſought reaſon god afflicteth men ſee none ſome man walked vprightly cace muſt brydle ſelues know god purpoſe vntill hee ſhewe vnto v lo howe ought iudge reſpecte others herewithall ſee wicked puniſhed haue deſerued let v onely condemne alſo applye ſame oure owne vſe according saincte paule ſheweth whiche wee ſhoulde walke feare god take warning mennes harmes beholde god puniſheth vvhoremongers theeues rebelles ende wee ſhould learne walke obedience prouoke wrathe thoſe whome wee ſee ſo roughly handeled thing whiche wee haue doe god maketh v beholde vengeance ſuch haue bene vtterly rebellious againſte wee ſee good men viſited behoueth v thinke ala greene tree bee caſt fire ſhall become drie vvhen wee compare oure ſelues ſuche manner halfe oute worlde alreadie wee ſhall ſee verie greate vertues yet notwithſtanding handeled muche greeuouſlye wee therefore wee muſte needes ſaye god beareth v hee pytied v ſhoulde become v wee bee wakened meanes let v aſſure ſelues ende wee ſhoulde take libertie doe euill reſtreyne v tye v vp intente wee ſhoulde ſubmit oure ſelues wholly vnto oure god vvhen wee haue ſo conſidered ſcourges affliction god ſendeth vpon oure neyghbours let v oure ſide oure turne commeth bee puniſhed god hande yea euen oure ſinnes acknowledge needeth witneſſe oure owne conſcience alſo ſufficient iudge condemne v afterward god time rough v ſee reaſon yet let heartes fayle v neyther let v vexe ſelues diſputing god though hee doe wee woulde haue rather let v learne comfort ſelues although god ſeeme bee mortall enemie thunder againſt v yet notwithſtanding let v truſt wee haue ſeene iob ſpeake heeretofore thus yee ſee howe ought diſcrete iudging chaſtizementes god ſendeth v alſo ought verie mylde towardes oure neighbour thing haue beare away ſentence eliu hee ſayeth follie men gaze ſo much preſent affliction ſay bycauſe god hande rough harde ſharpe vpon creature therefore hee vtterly ouerthroweth ſay muſt followe generall rule wee ſhould beguyled aſſayes haue ſhewed alreadie nowe herevpon eliu vpbraydeth iobs freendes confounded wayted ſayth ſpake gaue ouer talke heereby betokeneth confounded bycauſe euill grounded wee knowe truth alwayes inuincible true hath good cace ſhall alwayes heard wee ſee good cace may bee oppreſſed braineleſſe frantike folke haue full ſcope ſtoppe mouthes ſuche haue iuſt cauſe ſpeake thinges goe orderly man haue good cace god gyueth wherewith mainteine truth ſayd ſhall haue vpper hande naught eliu taunteth iobs freendes confounded middeſt way vvherfore let v aſſure oure ſelues knowe throughly thing true god alſo giue v argumentes reaſons mainteine ende vanquiſhed ſuche laboure beate downe truth turne lye god ſay ſo ſtrengthen v wee ſhall neuer bee deſtitute reaſon doctrine well worthy bee marked cauſe oftentimes wee dare vndertake good quarell wee haue ſtoutneſſe skill reſiſt ſo ſtedfaſtly requiſite nowe ende ſuche fearefulneſſe ſhould hinder v beeing zealous mainteyning truth wee ought let v marke god forſaketh thoſe haue courage maynteine good caces giueth victorie ende yea although bee oppreſſed ſubtiltie wilyneſſe may ſo come paſſe haue ſayde yet notwithſtanding ſhall neuer bee cōnfounded howe ſo euer worlde goe let v truſt promiſe referre oure ſelues vnto god wee ſhall finde ſayd vaine true aboue al thing behoueth v diſcern whether cace maintein bee good god puniſheth lightneſſe ſuch take matter hande knowe howe leaueth aſſone haue opened mouth become laughingſtockes vnto men beholde iuſt rewarde ſuch ouerhaſtie putting forth themſelues wee bee ſure goodneſſe cace let v reſt vpon whiche ſayde vnto v heere witte god ſo ſtrengthen v wee ſhall bee ouercome furthermore wee ſee ſometimes ſuche ought mainteine good cace play goſlings ſtand deade abaſhed let v marke god puniſheth ſuch fayntheartedneſſe giueth ſuch courage ought haue bicauſe called hung vpon ſo muche thought holie ghoſte able ynoughe giuethem ſtrength vnbeleefe ſheweth ſelfe adays good cace ſhall thruſt vnder foot ye ſee wicked haue courage inough much ſet forth lie withſtande comming forth truth wicked fayle apply ſtrayne ſelues vttermoſt ouerthrowe thing bring matter confuſion mean man ſetteth himſelfe againſt leaſtwiſe ſuch courage requiſite ſuch willing well haue ſome affection notwithſtanding faint beleefe ſurely truſted god wold ſuffer thing bee confounded bee thus ye ſee haue conſider eliu taunteth iobs friend confounded much ſhould ſaye thereby apparant euill cace made wrong matche againſt iob hee addeth hee alſo ſpeake turne worde alſo ought well weyed thereby eliu betokeneth hee putteth foorth aduice due time vvhy haue tolde alreadie bycauſe hee yong man ought haue yelded reuerence aged otherwiſe bin peruerting order nature therefore behoued modeſtie goe eliu ſhould ſuffer elder ſpeake heare done much god giueth grace diſcerne cace better done alſo ſpeaketh turne vvee ſee hee runneth heade ſay thruſteth himſelfe matter aduenture holdeth peace till conuenient time ſerueth ſpeaketh poynt ought mark verie well know god church thing ought bee handled orderly comely saint paule ſayth therefore two thing requiſite manner teaching firſt order bee obſerued ſecondly order matched honeſtie ſo thing may bee comely conuenient seeing ſo let v beare mynde example eliu let v holde v doctrine saint paule giueth v ſayde texte whiche diſorder amongeſt v according alſo sainct paule ſayth another ſtreine text alledged althoughe god haue rayſed vp many prophetes church many haue skill ſpeake yea alſo wherwith teach yet notwithſtanding vtter forth giuen thē behoueth order meaſure alſo certaine honeſt comelineſſe kepte therefore thing ſhewed v heere example eliu ſayth ſpeake yea ſeeth thing miſordered iobs freendes diſguiſed truth mainteined euill falſe principle although vſed fayre apparant reaſons colour matter yet notwithſtanding foundation whervpon builded good iob alſo ſide althoughe cace iuſt yet notwithſtanding handle amiſſe vſed many wandring wordes therefore eliu hearkned quietly nowe ſeeth god giueth entrance acceſſe vſeth beſides hee alſo conſtreyned doe ſo according ſheweth hee addeth heart greeued hee like caske full newe wine man put newe wine intoo caske cloſe vp giue vent caske burſteth wine boyleth euen ſo ſayeth eliu mynde ſhet vp caske full newe wine coulde holde longer muſte needes burſt heereby hee meeneth neceſsitie conſtreyneth put forth opinion end cace beene euill debated might nowe bee ordered reaſon bycauſe eliu ſpeaketh heere great vehemencie ſome perceyuing cauſe haue thought bee man loftie mynde full boſting firſt al ſee god condemneth vvhereas condemneth iob freendes ſheweth doone amiſſe one way yet notwithſtanding eliu iuſtified nowe ſeeing god condemneth mortall man ſhall take vpon authoritie iudge aboue god therfore great follie moreouer muſt bee thought ſo ſtrange thing muſt beare mynde howe hath beene declared heeretofore eliu one prophetes god church god publiſhed lawe hande moyſes hee promiſeth alſo people iſraell ſhould neuer deſtitute prophetes written deutr thou ſhalt goe sorcerer soothſayers thou ſhalt ſeeke ſuch reuelations heathen thou ſhalt run witchcraft vaine ſciences neither ſhalte thou aske counſell deade thy god ſhall alwayes rayſe thee vp prophete middes thee hee ſhould ſay heathen men ſeeke ſearch many wayes taught knowe haue prophete certeyne doctrine leade guyde thē ſo ſayde god child iſraell alwayes giue ſome prophete ſo dwell familiarly among truth ſhall bee knowne vnto thus prophetes churche god according promiſe continually common thing eliu dwelled amōg ſuch folke lawe promiſes god neyther lorde make couenaunt thoſe people either lawe elſe among idolater according haue told thare nachor great grandfather aunceters eliu idolater seeing eliu inſtructed god skill ſpeake wee haue ſeene ſame extraordinarie matter therefore muſt thinke ſtrange great operation god ſheweth heere vnaccuſtomed power eliu alſo feeleth ſelfe chaunged intent propheſies ſhould haue authoritie wee ſee god hathe time ſet ſome apparant markes like god called saule kingdom ſo changed renued ſeemed 〈…〉 ite cleane another man beene afore texte ſelfe ſayth saule alſo among prophetes god ſo touched thoſe prophetes quicke called ſtate according promiſe ſame cuſtomable order ſay chaunged ſuche wiſe appeared menne rauiſhed muche reaſon wrought heathen man church muſt needes ſome notable marke behalf ſo world might know god hand vpon howebeit much diuell alwayes ape god counterfayter workes like befell falſe prophetes alſo infidelles whiche brought reuelations name idol alſo rauiſhed vvhen man came inquire ſecrete thing idolles fame renoume foretelling thing come prophet eyther men woman whiche halfe deade ſhoulde anſwere ſuche came inquire drewe wordes like thoſe falne intoo falling ſickneſſe fomed mouth eye turned heades done purpoſely bycauſe diuell would bleare eye ignorant wretch ſot ſuch faſhion ſhould moued reuerence whether would howe needes muſt bee heauenly power folkes ſay ſeeing men woman ſo changed ſayde doone satan pollicie certeine ſlight counterfait god workes ſo diſguiſe himſelfe ſort end men ſhoulde diſcerne rather thinke thinges came hell proceded heauen neuertheleſſe ſee wel cauſe ought think ſtrange eliu ſuch vehement pang mind god ordeined purpoſe vndertake incounter againſt iob freends yea requiſite god ſhould woorke newe faſhion man youth ſelfe ſhall heard among men bicauſe old men make great account age thinke themſelues great abilitie wiſdome maketh ſo much arrogant meanes thereof ſo forepoſſeſſed fooliſh opinion cannot finde hart taught great hardneſſe force therfore behoued god touch eliu quicke make great alteration mind end doctrine might haue ſome entrance receyued amōg elder ſhort god mēt authorize eliu gaue ſuch vehemēcie mind alſo reaſon haue touched namely ſawe truth oppreſſed inſomuch iob mainteyned quarell amiſſe although good men diſguiſed thing made euil foundation abuſing talke concerned god alledging good holy reaſons proof wrong principle taken therefore ſight moued zeale conceiued himſelfe heart boyle within would haue made burſt diſcharged himſelfe ought ſerue v double vſe firſt ſith ſee god hath printed ſuch marke doctrine eliu heauenly ſpirite apparant mouth much ought moued receyue ſayings purpoſe hath god marked ſo ende ſhoulde haue reuerence among v foraſmuch god hath put seale thing eliu ſhall diſcourſe hereafter woulde doctrine ſhould thereby made certaine vnto vs▪ let v receiue doctrine mortall man let v learne hereby ſubmit oure ſelues vnto let v bee ſure fayth ſhall grounded vpon doctrine creature god ſpeaketh mouth man vſeth inſtrument lo haue marke howbeeit behoueth v paſſe namely marke dimme eliu ought ſerue make v receyue doctrine fuller obedience ſayd great notable proofes god hath giuen v law prophecy true eliu bringeth pure worde god behoueth v take thing proceede mouth thing come holy ghoſt bicauſe god hath ſtirred vp ſuch vehemēcie conſider god hath magnified approued lawe doctrine prophetes wee ſhall ſee faſhion much mightie lawe publiſhed ayre rored sky ſhaken thunder lightning trumpettes ſounded cloudes earth quaked mountaynes remoued ſheepe voice god ſhort element gaue recorde doctrine ſhewing altogither heauenly alſo followed miracle prophet ſpake heauenly power appeared alwayes ſo great proofe ought put eies▪ ſee therfore ſeeing know god one onely marke gaue vnto eliu ſhould cauſe doctrine eliu receiued ſufficiēt authoritie let v vnderſtand law prophet come queſtion ought haue reaſō moued ſtirred vp according thing ſpoken eliu appurtenance thus ye ſee haue mark firſt place ſecond behoueth v alſo marke lyke eliu moued zeale ſaw men diſguiſe god truth falſifie worde muſt alſo haue like minde leaſt falſe prophet 〈…〉 ſe vp deface good doctrine wicked men diſguiſe blaſphemies perſwade world deſpiſe god worde
