euill cace mainteyned men go ouerthrow right let v bee dumbe careleſſe let v haue ſame vehemencie v ſhewed v heere haue godly zeale towardes god truth ſhewe ſelues bee none child therefore let v marke well example ſet foorth heere perſone eliu yea let v make compariſon betwene ſelues man brought vp god ſchole intangled among infidelles moued ſuch zeale god touched hee irned hee ſhoulde haue burſt tyll hee diſcharged conſcience pray ſhoulde wee doo god teacheth v ſo familiarly woorde wee bee excuſed wee yeelde recorde vntoo men ſuch tyme wee ſee goodneſſe defaced yea vtterly razed yet ſet ſelues agaynſt ſeeing oure lorde calleth v therevnto layeth ſuch charge vpon v bee dumbe make account mainteyning good rather doo helpe wicked ſilence traytors god truth yes doubtleſſe behoueth v moued ſith ſee man bin inſtructed lawe god bodie church notwithſtanding ſuch earneſt mainteyne truth maner inforced true inforcement willing god intendeth bee ſerued men hee caryeth away make go conſtreynt meane prophetes true ſeruantes hee ſerue owne turne wicked whether no▪ ſpeake heere thoſe whome hee giueth ſpirit prophecie whome hee maketh ſerue without giuing good coulde well ſpeake mouth balaam yet notwithſtanding wee ſee balaam ſtill deceyuer holy ghoſt ſetteth forth reproche ſlaunder eliu god ſtirred vp prophete ſo hee ſerued good ſay ouercame lettes might turne away mayntayning truth nowe adayes alſo ſee truth oppreſſed ſo ſome men mocke v otherſome go aboute byte v yea eate v vp bycauſe wee maintein truth let v fight againſt ſuch temptation inforcement ought ſette v forwarde sometimes wee bee aſhamed maynteyne good quarell bycauſe wee ſee men make mocke ſcoffers ſcorne god alſo ſo malapert bleare theyr tongue v laugh allegation ſcorne god truth muſte bee deſpiſable vnto v though worlde reiect let theſe temptation withholde v fighting valiantly agaynſt wee ſee ſelues readie hated men practiſe miſcheefs againſt v mainteyning good quarelles let v giue ouer true ynough draw v backe ſtoppe mouth neuertheleſſe behoueth v fight agaynſt ſuch temptation example eliu ye ſee god ſeruants ought bee fully reſolued ſwarue confeſsing truth neede requireth finally eliu ſayth ſhall accepting perſons vſe flatterie bycauſe ſhould ſooth men cannot tell whether maker would destroy eliu meeneth ſay effect brideled authoritie man hee ſhoulde ſpeake freely commeth mainteyning god truth bee layde forth length nowe therefore ynough v haue elius meening surely euill thing vtterly condemned call man honourable tytle howbeeit foraſmuch ſame doth oftentymes hinder v abaſhe v hande ſo wee haue ſuch libertie requiſite dutie ſpeaking plainly flatly ought doo therefore dooth eliu ſay giue tytles men ſay exaltmen ſo high truth ſhall bee aboue let v beare minde although lawfull v yeelde honour vnto men yea ought inſomuch muſt honour onely ſuperiours equal alſo inferiours according ſcripture commaundeth v yet notwithſtanding whether toward equalles towarde inferiours towarde ſuch ſurmount v degree alwayes truth muſt preferred men although wee yeelde euerie man honour belongeth hee deſerueth yet let v ceaſſe ſpeake alwayes freely without accepting perſones according wee knowe ſpeake god name hee haue v without feigning▪ intende honour god meete deſerueth behoueth v vtter wordes freely ſpeake men ſayde bee impeachment yeelding euerie man due honour yet wee muſt haue mouthes ſhet euerie v muſt follow owne calling commeth turne ſpeake muſt ſpeake truth ye ſee haue beare away laſt ſaying elius ende ſuch beare office common weale ſhoulde ſpeake freely ought euerie v although haue office teaching pronouncing ſentence publikely ſhoulde neuertheleſſe confeſſe truth freely requyred handes aſſuring ſelues god accepteth ſacrifice honour done vnto wee ſo onely keeping rule giuen v alſo honouring exalting aboue creature nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele better wee haue done bringing thereof paſſe wee may preſume aught ſelues knowing well cannot open mouth except hee guide gouerne v holy ſpirite therefore may pleaſe inſtruct v ſuch wiſe wee may haue mouth open ſpeake neede requireth wee may followe owne affection luſtes ſpeaking life may agreeable therevnto bee beſtowed ſuche obedience towardes god wee may ſeeke nothing frame wholy holy wil although wee bee ſubiect muche wretchedneſſe corruption paſsing worlde yet wee may fayle labour ſtill full perfection wherevnto god call v wee ſhall haue glorified worlde may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing back poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage errour darkeneſſe right way ſaluation c cxxij sermon first vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon three laſt verſes former chapter vpon text followeth therefore iob heare thou talke hearken vnto vvordes 2 beholde haue opened mouth tongue ſhall ſpeake palat 3 vvordes rightneſſe heart lippes ſhall vtter pure doctrine 4 ſpirit god hath created breath almightie hath giuen life 5 thou canſt anſvvere prepare thy ſelfe agaynſt debate thy cace ſtoutely 6 beholde godvvarde thou according thine ovvne mouth alſo formed clay 7 feare mee trouble thee although preſſe thee yet ſhall bee heauie burthen thee haue begonne alreadie lay foorth proteſtation eliu made ſpeaking rightly without regarde men hath beene declared man ſpeake rightly godlily muſt haue eye ſhet accept perſons led either hatred fauor nothing wel ruled v wil nothing trouble specially ſtandeth vpon teaching god name behoueth v bee well aduiſed turne away fleſhly affection eliu ſaid purpoſely god might roote ſhoulde haue reſpect men greatneſſe might ſeeme hard firſt ſight god ſhoulde deſtroy one magnifying ſome man greatneſſe howbeeit let v marke firſt god graunteth v grace ſpeake name behoueth v yeelde authoritie worde aduaunce eſtimation thereof wee bee ſo turned aſyde looking vnto creature ſpeake freely wee ought doo diſhonouring god man bee ſent earthly prince ſuffer men ſcorne playeth gooſe dare preferre meſſage committed vnto ſuch lozelrie pardoned beholde god receyueth v ſeruice euen v duſt euen v altogither vnprofitable putteth v honourable commiſsion beare abrode worde haue bee borne abrode authoritie reuerence nowe man doth ſo diſmay v wee diſguiſe god truth turne lie elſe brue ſuch wiſe ſhal put quite owne nature pray great reproche bee done vntoo god god worde caryed abrode ſo ſoundly freely men may honour maruell though puniſhment bee prepared eliphas ſpeaketh thus haue double leſſon gather text one ſuch preach god worde office teache ſhepeherdes theſe muſt ſettle themſelues ſuch conſtancie ſwarue howſoeuer worlde go according ſayde ieremie muſt take foreheade braſſe fight withall bicauſe worlde neuer bee without great ſtubbornneſſe ſuch exalted dignitie honourable ſtate cannot yeeld themſelues ſubiection obedience vnto god alwayes ſet vp briſtles againſt nowe ſeeing ſo forget themſelues cannot ſtoupe hath created faſhioned behoueth v haue inuincible conſtancie make reckning ſhall haue enmitie diſpleaſure wee dutie yet neuertheleſſe let v go throughout without ſwaruing aſide lo haue marke ſide ſay ordeined paſtors preach worde god notwithſtanding behoueth people receyue generall inſtruction therefore come heare sermon let v carie ſuch loftie ſtomackē v checke agaynſt god bee reproued ſinnes let v cary ſuch bitterneſſe bee angry galled backes bee rubbed neither let v bee ſo fooliſh ouerwiſe thinke god ought hold peace v neither let v ſeeke borne withall vnder colour ſome good qualitie v though king prince yet behoueth v bowe downe neckes receyue god yoke loftineſſe muſt bee pulled downe paule ſayth ſecond corinthian cauſe goſpell preached end great ſmall ſhoulde ſubmit themſelues vnto god ſuffer themſelues gouerned thing cannot done except caſt downe loftineſſe paule ſayth place exalteth ſelfe againſt maieſtie lord ieſus chriſt muſt tarie till inforced compelled obey god euery man muſt owne good let ſuch eſtate vnderſtand though king yet ought humble thēſelues preaching god truth muſt thinke thus themſelues lorde maiſter ſent preacheth euē ſoueraine lorde mankinde vntoo al men owe ſubiection meane degree pray ouerranke folly deſire men ſhoulde beare v winke faultes cloake yea worde god ſhoulde bee falſified oure ſakes god transforme himſelfe hee haue worde liuely image ſeeke bee flattered much wee woulde deſire god ſhoulde chaunge nature renounce himſelfe intent pleaſe v diueliſhe raſhneſſe let v learne come hearing god worde al humilitie mildneſſe aſſuring ſelues obedience muſt tried behalfe none muſt ſpared men faultes ſhewed rightfull libertie conuenient let v come eliu addeth iob ſayeth heare thou mee truely ſpeake tongue vtter wordes palat yet notwithſtanding ſaying rightneſſe heart thou ſhalt heare thing truth vprightneſſe mouth see heere proteſtation eliu maketh intēt heard wit hee ſpeake feynedly double minded man ſet downe thing purely according knew bin reueled vnto marke firſt poynt secondly addeth behold reſpect god thou art according thy mouth worde vſeth ſignifieth properly mouth howbeit ſometimes taken meaſure nowe wee haue ſeene heeretofore iob deſired god come without bringing ſuch terrour hee felt god match ſayth iob could anſwere although hee haue authoritie ouer mee yet could mainteyn cace lo maner iob ſpeaketh ſo ſentence might expounded thus beholde according thine owne mouth ſay according thou haſt deſired elſe thus beholde according thy meaſure ſay like vnto thee reſpect god neuertheleſſe meening abide alwayes one therefore neede ſtande much vpon worde let v conſider ſtill wherevntoo eliu intendeth come witte hee god might make iob afrayde created clay iob ſay mortall tranſitorie creature hath ſtrength himſelfe ſayth ſpirit god hath faſhioned breath almightie hath giuen mee life bee ſhort ſee eliu telleth iob wil ſpeake againſt ſu •• reaſō ſhall ouercome thou ſhalt alledge ſayeth god maketh thee afraid glory terrible thee thou canſt haue right hande thou ſhalt bee able ſay ſo beholde wretched lumpe earth myre true haue breath life howbeit haue god yet full frailtie thou ſhall nothing ouerſway betwene v two reaſon thou muſt faine confounded vve ſee effect two poynts conteyned firſt eliu declareth wordes rightneſſe heart wil ſpeake thing hee hath thought conceyued himſelfe well worthie noted therevpon may gather ſort hee ought bee diſpoſed beareth worde god namely hee muſt haue ſtore bibblebabble tongue ende caſt forth wordes aduenture yet play enter lude according god hath taught ſo muſt deale forth thing printed heart vntoo thoſe ouer god hath giuē charge ſerue god purely office behoueth v firſt moſt brydle tongue ſpeake thing printed hart ſurely heare ſaid dauid likewiſe alledged paule applyeth miniſters god worde haue beleeued therefore ſpeake true thing common chriſtians child god ought cheefly obſerued thoſe god hath ordeyned inſtruments holy ſpirite vvhenſoeuer wee ſpeake god heard perſons seeing hath done v ſo great honour leaſtwiſe doctrine ought printed v take roote afterward mouth ſhould beare witneſſe knowe bee ſhort behoueth v haue beene taught god good maiſters teacher ſpecially preach let onely teach others let v comprehend ſelues ſame number companie beholde ſay haue marke vndoubtedly man ſpeaketh god worde without feeling operation himſelfe doth elſe play part enterlude trecherie vvhat defiling god worde let v think v throughly oft go vp pulpit let v remember well leſſon giuen v namely rightneſſe hart muſt ſhew ſelfe tongue therewithall alſo wee ſee doctrine good man ſpeaketh laboureth edifie v let v know vnthankfull vtterly rebellious agaynſt god heare matter humilitie nowe eliu maketh preface ſpeaketh maner men way curteſie ſheweth ſort god intendeth holde v himſelfe meanes behold ſayth heare mee nothing right talke one hee ſet downe rule god name doctrine preached bee good holy conuinced ſo yeeld reuerence frame ſelues thereafter ſhall guiltie reſiſting man one ſpited liuing god let euerie v bee attentiue god worde preached ſeeing h • ſo gracious vnto v rayſe vp men declare familiarly vnto v let v wilde folke let v yeeld ourſelues teacheable thing know proceede foraſmuch lawe prophet goſpell haue conueyed vnto v ſuch maner men whoſe vprightneſſe well ynough knowne witneſſed let v marke whoſoeuer ſubmitteth himſelfe doctrine needeth proces damnation bee ſhort let v marke lord hath authoriſed prophet apoſtles end doctrine haue giuē v ſhould doubted taken vnrepealable decree marke one poynt herewithall bee warned faythfull muſt become ſo ſheepiſh receyue whatſoeuer tolde muſt examine doctrine whether god cauſe ſayd muſt trie ſpirites muſt well noted ſee wretched papiſts ſuffer themſelues led without diſcretion fayth haue nothing meere ſheepiſhneſſe men muſt ſtoppe eies haue reaſon contrarywiſe god ſhoulde haue skill diſcretion abuſed ſeduced falſe doctrine men ſhall bring v ſhall done truely muſt preſume iudge god truth according owne wit fancie muſt rather captiue reaſon vnderſtanding scripture ſheweth v neuertheleſſe wee muſt therewithall pray god giue v diſcretion diſcerne whether thing ſet v good right furthermore let v al lowlineſſe deſire gouerned vnder hande aſſuring ſelues meanes wee ſhall knowe whether right matter told v alſo thing lorde ieſus chriſt alledgeth haue v receyue ſayings ſeeke mine owne glorie ſayth glorie ſent mee therefore behoueth v alwayes ſearche ende man tendeth ſpeaketh vnto v wee ſee marke whiche hee ſhooteth god ſhoulde glorified reigne ouer men muſt bee diſputing agaynſt wee muſt reſt fully contrarie part doctrine tende defacing god glorie turning v ſeruice aduauncing ambition vanitie ſo builde v vp bee true temple god grounde v vppon god remitte ſelues wholly vntoo call vppon purely reſt ſelues vpon grace fatherly goodneſſe doo wee ſee rightneſſe true ſhoulde bee fore combred cace god firſt ſhewed v maner one rightneſſe wee haue principle hee hathe gyuen v wee neuer ſwarue vnleſſe bee long ſelues beholde god telleth v hee bee exalted haue men acknowledge goodneſſe commeth againe alſo haue lordeſhip power ouer life therin holde v ſo awe may gouerned according good haue men vtterly abaced bereft truſt owne rightuouſneſſe wiſdome ſtrength haue v come draw water lord ieſus chriſt fountaine goodneſſe hee haue v call vpon purely haue sacrament hath ordeyned receiued warrant grace meanes helpes v ſerue ſo much free earneſt hart theſe thing wherein gloſe darkneſſe difficultie let v always haue touchſtone v come trying doctrine ſhall perceyue whether right wrong true falſe pure corrupted mingled according true rightneſſe god hath ſhewed v ſay wee neede bee wrapped doubt behalfe onely let v open eye therewithall pray god guide v holy ſpirit without ſhall alwayes wander able diſcerne ſo much little child according paul ſaith god ſpirit muſt creſſet giue v light elſe ſhall neuer comprehend god ſecrets ſpirituall nature fleſhly earthly alwayes beare downwarde god inlighten v holy ſpirit wee iudge doctrine diſcerne ſuch wiſe cannot deceyued satan temptation although ſend v deceiuers rayſe vp many turmoilers labour turne thing vpſide downe yet cannot preuaile thing againſt v ſo long god ſpirit light haue ſayde alreadie furthermore although god ſometimes ſpeake mouthes wicked according ſayde kingdome lord ieſus chriſt ſhal furthered occaſion ſo hypocrits folk haue feare god led vainglorie vanity ſhall ſerue time god make doctrine auailable ſaluation choſen howbeit greater cōdemnation themſelues although ſay may come paſſe yet notwithſtanding ordinarie meane pleaſeth god haue v edifyed immediately hee rayſeth vp men ſpeake hartily zealouſly yea giueth ſuch marke worde commeth mouth men may knowe working holy ghoſt according alſo saint paule ſayeth heere yee ſee ſuch office preache god worde ought ſo much better practiſe whiche haue ſayde witte learne well themſelues teach others ſo heart may ſpeake mouth bringing hereof paſſe let pray god ſo touch quicke may haue woorde well rooted theyr mindes may able ſerue neighbour perceyue thruſt forth themſelues aduenture drawne holy ghoſt ye ſee wee haue remember ſtreyne nowe ſeconde place eliu proteſteth hee tranſitorie frayle man ſo hee cannot make iob afrayed neuertheleſſe winne thing hand reaſon truth wee come cheefe poynt way wee haue marke maner ſpeache vſed ſpirit god hath created breath almightie hath giuen life hee myre clay truely well worthie bee noted men could beare well minde ſhewed heere vndoubtedly pride would buried v cauſe men glory ſo much themſelues ſo full ouerweening firſt knowe theyr owne originall beginning ſecondly haue skill conſider good earneſt looke whatſoeuer haue hold god heritage vnto haue life appurtenance therof bicauſe pleaſeth god preſerue men could firſt conſider whence come ſecondly whatſoeuer goodneſſe hold god mere grace certain ſhould rightly meekned therfore ſayd faſhioned myre clay let v go boaſt ſelues make great vaunt liſt yet ſhall able chaūge nature vvherefore man feeleth himſelfe tempted pride ſo would exalt himſelfe much let enter intoo himſelfe conſider whence hee came thing god tooke onely feete myrie ſeemeth v wee leſſe woorth myre touch v thinke ſelues defiled yea doo hang ſhooes yet made clay therefore wee ought ſo forget oure pedegree whence wee come namely earth duſt true ſaying common ynough euery man confeſſeth meane ſeaſon man acknowledgeth ſuch conceyte ynough purge v pryde vvhat elſe preſumption ouerweening men onely windineſſe bycauſe puffed vp ignorance haue forgotten themſelues much ought wey wel ſpeech wherein ſayde wee bee created clay myre true ſome worthineſſe excellencie nature meete commended throughly whole ſounde yet lawfull v proude ſeeing ſo corrupted adam bee certaine ought double aſhamed wee created image god maner image nowe disfigured one wee bee ſo defaced marke god put v bee glorified thereby turned diſhonour gracious gift beſtowed vpon v become many recordes make v guiltie god bycauſe wee defile ſo long wee continue owne nature wee abuſe benefites wee haue receyued applie vnto euill ſo ye ſee alwayes confuſion increaſeth giftes god hath beſtowed amongeſt v yet let v put cace vncorrupted euer oure father adam fyrſt wee therfore preſume ſelues vnder colour god ſo innobled v truely holde thing vvhat putteth difference betwene v brute beaſts maketh v excellent haue wee oure owne purchaſe haue gotten owne ſtrength haue inheritance forefather haue god free gift owne meere goodneſſe done onely humble ſelues thing haue gather ingenerall vpon ſtreyne eliu confeſſeth himſelfe bee made clay beholden god life breath bycauſe beſtowed vpon meere goodneſſe nowe way thoſe god haue ſerue ſtate honour ought remember leſſon better god reacheth men hand ſetteth ſome degree honour ende ſhoulde vaunte themſelues rather acknowledge howe much bounde vnto bee ſo muche prouoked honour ſharpening applying al wittes affection worke ſuche wiſe god might bee honoured according ſayde candle muſt bee hidde ſet vpon table cupborde may giue light ouer houſe thoſe god hath ſhewed fauour exalt hie worthie calling ought inflamed inlighten theyr neighbour giue ſuch example grace haue receyued may choked thing haue marke ſeconde place herewithall let v marke generally men cannot yeelde god due glorie except ſtrippe themſelues ſtarke naked ſo long pretende reſerue thing ſelues bee neuer ſo little glorie god ſhall bee ſo much diminiſhed vvhat bee done vvhen wee haue well ſearched grace benefites wee haue let v make ſo many item receyts account acknowledge wee haue nothing oure owne verie way men kepe themſelues robbing god prayſe indeuer know thēſelues remaineth one drop goodneſſe euery whit muſt put inuentorie according alſo accountable afore god furthermore bee ſo brought nothing ſelues ſuſteyne loſſe ſhall fayle apparelled againe yea truly ioined vnto god yeeld vnto due prayſe ſhall much richer thoſe ſo full ouerweening ſurmizing thēſelues haue wote kind inheritance let v loth diminiſhed ſo vtterly ſtripped glory lord ſuffer v vnfurniſhed goodneſſe yet notwithſtanding behoueth v ſo abaced haue ſaid beſides know nothing giuē v frō aboue let v apply al thing god putteth v ſuch vſe cōmandeth lord hath indued v giftes holy ſpirit ſame ſhoulde otherwiſe applied good vſe ſhoulde bee vnprofitable therfore let v well aduiſed thing haue receiued preſented offred ſacrifize vnto god ſeing wil haue welfare neighbour aduaunced let v aboue thing haue regarde edifie one another lo wee haue beare minde let v come talke eliu holdeth ſubſtance ſayd ſpirit god hath created breath hath giuen life addeth terribleneſſe mee make thee afrayde onely reaſon ſhall beare ſway heere eliu ſheweth duetie good teacher namely looke well himſelf view cōſider himſelf open mouth haue knowne owne frailtie wil haue cōpaſsion neighbour fall rebuking ſuche haue done amiſſe go ſuch rigour ſhall rather make wretched wanderer ſtray bring way commeth comforting haue skill howe come teaching diſdayne therefore teach god worde ought let v begin knowing owne infirmity bee well acquainted lead v modeſtie meekneſſe ſo wee ſhall milde heart viter worde god true foraſmuch many full pryde ſtubborneſſe worde god need vnto hammer brooſe breake hardneſſe yet notwithſtanding wee ought firſt formoſt teach thoſe yeeld thēſelues teachable may knowe neede haue beare beare cannot except feele fraile ſelues hee knoweth owne wantes hath compaſsion partake men ſorowes comfort teach ignorant faythfully wee muſt vnderſtande nothing ignorance ſelues bin worſe v men god giuen v thing whiche wee haue receyued againe comfort wretched afflicted let v firſt vnderſtande afflicted let v haue paſſed way ſelues let v touched greefe heauineſſe may comfort ſelues others ſorrow haue skill beare furthermore rebuke ſuch haue done amiſſe let v ouer great rigour rather let v pitie deſtruction true ſometymes vehemencie muſt needes ioyned wee ſee wretched ſoules periſh time cocker men bee wilfull ſtubborneſſe muſt ſtrike alſo wound quicke yea yet therewithall behoueth v haue poynt aforehand namely haue bin acquainted infirmity grieue v deale rigorouſly like although father beate child vſe much rougher word would ſtrangers yet notwithſtanding hart bleedeth hee faine tranſforme himſelfe ſort let v marke man ſhal neuer meete teacher except haue put fatherly affection firſt knowe owne infirmitie ende may frame himſelf ſuch pitifulneſſe may haue cōpaſſion al ſuch hath deale withal thing ſhewed v eliu furthermore let ſuch placed authoritie conſider wel muſt abuſe power vnto tyrānie oppreſſe thoſe vnder ſhal haue double account make god vnder colour theyr authoritie haue men feare ſtande awe ſeeke cheefly honour god welfare thoſe committed vnto ſee ezechiell ſpeaketh euill ſheepherds haue miſintreated god people tyrannie ſaith reigned ouer rigor lordlineſſe yea contrariwiſe ſhewed v ſuch wil quite themſelues faithfully towards god neighbour ſet hie degree muſt therfore aduaūce themſelues rather know intend carrie terror put poore folke feare god muſt faine ſhew minde ſet wilde beaſts ſcare flock goates puſh horne trouble water ſpeaketh ſayd text ezechiel god ſhew thoſe hath giuen ſwoorde ſeat iuſtice thoſe hath put pulpit teach worde ſet goates treade downe oppreſſe ſilly ſheepe lo haue marke text herewithall eliu ſheweth maner ought receyue doctrine wit know true right muſt hande paſſe without gainſaying although forced conſtrayned vnto ye ſee haue beare mind concerning circumſtance place matter wit good doctrine propounded vnto v well mortall man ſpeaketh wee ſee hee hath reaſon truth let v aſſure ſelues replying againſt fight onely againſt god alſo againſt owne conſcience ſufficient iudge cōdemne v herewithall haue verie profitable warning gather whenſoeuer wee come bee taught name god ſee doctrine offered v right muſt replying wee ſhall win nothing reaſon behoueth v ſubmit ſelues furthermore ought hinder v ſetting god maieſtie eies muſt iudge doctrine ſet forth vntoo v according owne wit fancie therefore two thing need matched togither one fully determine ready obey god concluding ſelues maker ought haue ſoueraintie ouer v ought ſubiect vnto preparatiue muſt made aforehand afterward muſt enter iudgement ſay muſt examine doctrine howbeeit pride opinion wee bee wiſe ynough ſelues praying vntoo god gouerne v holy ſpirit may follow doctrine ſhal haue ſhewed v thus ye ſee two thing ought bee matched togither matching mingling bringeth confuſion prepared obey god leaue open eye conſider ought diſcerne vntruth truth howbeeit herewithall let v learne ſo frowarde haue regarde man ſpeaketh let v conſider god ſheweth v great fauour pleaſeth vſe creature abace himſelfe ſort vnto v ende ſhould haue leyſure conſider worde ſhould come vnto v maieſtie ſhould vndone offreth himſelfe v men applyeth himſelfe infirmitie intent wee might commodiouſly know truth ſetteth v ye ſee effect haue remember ſtreyne reſt ſhall reſerued till another time let v fall face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele wretchedneſſe wee may bee taught chalenge thing ſelues bee abuſed vaine folly acknowledge wee bee altogither miſerable therevpon deſire ſuccoured mercy thankfull benefites hee hath alreadie beſtowed vpon v ende gracious goodneſſe continuing towards v wee may learne apply glorifying holy name dedicate vnto ſeruice beſeeching beare weakeneſſe vntill haue vtterly ridde v transformed v owne glorie ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe according truth worthie lift vp eye c cxxiij sermon ſecond vpon xxxiij chapter 8 doubtleſſe thou haſt ſpoken mine eares haue heard voyce thy ſaying 9 pure vvithout ſinne cleane novnrightuouſneſſe 10 hath found occaſion agaynſt taken enimie 11 hath put feete ſtockes taken heede vvayes 12 thou ſhalt iuſtified vvill anſvvere thee god greater thou 13 vvhy ſtriueſt thou agaynſt vvill anſvvere vvordes 14 god ſpeaketh tvvice men heare muſt call minde treated yeſterday wit god doth v great pleaſure vouchſafeth applie himſelfe ſo farre infirmitie ſpeake familiarly vnto v mouthe mortall man whiche like vntoo ſelues ende beeing put feare maieſtie wee ſhould haue better leyſure think vpon thing ſheweth v ſo may haue quiet troubled minde conceyue well doctrine wee heare make profite true god ſpake v heauen woulde moue v conſequently doctrine ſhould authoritie howbeeit meane ſeaſon would agaſt ſo ſhould maſters wittes conſider ſayeth man ſpeaketh wee may better owne eaſe • aſte digeſt thing ſpoken yee ſee wiſe god beareth v surely wee ſee lawe bee publiſhed people iſraell ſayde let lorde ſpeake vnto v wee vndone muſt heare ſince time god begonne ſhewe maieſtie ſuch feare ſtriken intoo hart poore ſoules wiſt become inſomuch concluded god ſhoulde haue ſpoken ſtill ſhould haue bin deſtroyed vvhen moyſes came abrode faine hang continually veyle face bycauſe god giuen marke glorie iewes able abide wee ſee god rayſed vp men teach v therein hath reſpect vnto feebleueſſe vttereth power vnto v intent ſhoulde muche diſmayed might haue wittes libertie edified doctrine ſo ſame might familiar v wee haue leyſure thinke vpon applie ſtudie hereby warned muſt deſpiſe god worde preached vnto v men villanous vnthankefulneſſe v god ſhoulde abace humble himſelfe owne greatneſſe intent applie himſelfe vnabilitie take occaſion thereat make account thing hee ſayeth vnto v therefore although treaſure god woorde bee ſet v earthen veſſels ſay mortall men full infirmity yet muſte wee alwayes eſteeme deſerueth knowing men ſpeake owne name ſent vnto v god heard mouth nowe let v come vpbraydings eliu offereth vnto iob doubtleſſe thou haſt ſayde hearing haue heard voyce thy woordes thou art rightuous without ſinne thou art guiltie iniquitie therefore therein thou canſt iustifie thy ſelfe ſay thou canſt maintaine thy quarell thou haſt done amiſſe ſo howe wilt thou anſwere god ſeeing hee greater thou thoū accuſeſt hee hath ſought occaſion puniſh thee hee hath ſet thy feete ſtockes ſo thou haſt libertie mainteyne thy cace think thou eſcape thou muſt condemned god muſt make thee feele hee doth iuſtly puniſh thee ſort heere wee haue examine firſt al whether eliu charge iob wrongfully rightfully intent iuſtifie himſelfe ſeemeth firſt ſight hath miſtaken iobs talke hee turneth ſlaunderouſly another meening proofe heereof iob neuer went chalenge ſuch perfection haue ſinne wee haue ſeene contrarie therefore ſhould ſeeme eliu doth falſifie wordes heard apply contrary meening howbeit foraſmuch god blameth ſhal ſee haue already herd proteſted would aſſaile iob maner done let v marke taketh iobs wordes iob himſelf ment wit iob eye preſent affliction •• ſhould ſay true poore ſinner cannot denie haue committed many offence god finde ſelfe rightuous god vſeth hys abſolute power againſt ſee reaſon tormenteth ſort affliction ouer▪ greeuous although iob ment iuſtifie himſelf generally yet notwithſtanding ment iuſtifie himſelfe cace affliction ſeemeth eliu doth wrong ſtill behalfe alſo haue tolde alreadie deed god ment puniſh iob ſinnes although hee might haue done iuſtly thought ynough trie pacience iob reaſon ſeing knew framed himſelf ordinance god anſwere receyuing affliction god ſendeth v tryalles obedience haue perceyued god puniſheth v reſpect offence angry v rather intendeth humble v knowe whether wee bee ſubiect vntoo poyntes alſo mortifie luſtes wee forwardeneſſe wee muſte immediately haue conſideration whiche yet neuertheleſſe god well finde good cauſe puniſhe v pleaſe although god ſpare v vſe rygour towardes v reſpect ſinnes yet notwithſtanding may iuſt cauſe vvhy doth hee bicauſe goodneſſe yet meane hee afflicteth v ſome reſpect marke one poynt ſeconde god ſhewe v hee afflicteth v behoueth v caſt downe heades vntil come neerer v make v perceyue hee dealeth ſo v therefore wee ought tarie leyſure giue brydle affection iob fayled theſe two poyntes although acknowledged himſelfe bee ſinner yet notwithſtanding gaue god glorie whiche due vnto reaſon whereof hee ſufficiently minded poynt god hee liſted might haue puniſhed much rigorouſly yea euen ſinnes againe haue ſeene raunged abrode chafed himſelfe ſaying meeneth god wretched creature meere god ſhould ſtretch arme againſt reaſon dealing ſeemed hee ment accuſe god ſome tyrannie concluded ſo himſelfe hee tempted ſo thing wherein iob fayled therefore without cauſe eliu ſayeth vnto thou haſt ment iuſtifie thy ſelfe thou pure cleare without ſinne therein thou ſhalt neuer acquit get better ende ſtaffe intent may profite doctrine let v beare minde god puniſh v ſinnes behoueth v firſt yeeld ſelues guiltie nothing expedient intende bee iuſtified afore god el haue looke vnto owne lyfe knowe well worthie beaten god ſcourges ſeeing haue offended ſo many wayes notwithſtanding god haue ſome reſpect afflicting v yet handle v roughly ſuch altogither vnruly make vtter skorne god maieſtie lette v marke bicauſe ſinnes vvhy hee intendeth trie v make v knowe whither wholly ſo long thing go wee woulde haue knowe wee whether wee forwarde ſerue god no▪ muſt fayne renoūce owne ſubdue owne naturall witte vnderſtanding ſhort fight againſt owne affection true triall oure ſeruing god therfore cace ſhall ſtand ſo let v thinke ſelues truly god may iuſtly ouerwhelme hundred thouſand time although haue graunted mee grace walke feare indeuer ſelfe ſerue yet nothing could ſtand one minute houre vnleſſe vphild mee infinite goodneſſe surely vpholde mee howbeeit therewithall maketh mee ſubiect vnder hande ſheweth ought hang wholly vpō go doth good cauſe therefore behoueth v quiet ſo wee haue inquired god vexeth v ſo ſore perſecuteth v ſo extremely perceyue cauſe behooueth v conclude god thy determination incomprehenſible foraſmuch able knowe reaſon rudeneſſe infirmitie vnderſtanding wayte paciently till thou make perceiue cauſe lorde ſhall haue taried ſort like poore blinde ſoule thou wilt open mine eye make perceyue wherevnto theſe thing tende ſhall bee ende ſhall profite better yee ſee wiſedome ought faythfull haue ſuch mildeneſſe confeſſe alwayes god rightuous although perceyue reaſon workes heerewithall alſo muſte humilitie acknowledge themſelues wretched ſinners god mighte finde cauſe ynough make cleane riddance liſted beare owne meere grace thus ye ſee effect haue gather text let v come addeth god ſayth hath taken occaſion picked quarell mee thervpon hath ſette feete ſtockes tormented mee looked vnto pathes ſpieth mee hath eye ſo vpon cannot ſtirre finger haue committed faulte true iob intendeth accuſe god vnrightuouſnes puniſhing without cauſe howbeit herewithall let v marke well ſo caried away affection ther ſcaped many diſordered woords fit whiche excuſed haue noted heeretofore opportunitie required came place haue ſhewed iob skirmiſhed much againſt god yet ſtill pacient reſting full purpoſe glorifie notwithſtanding troubled time broughte ſo lowe wiſt howe recouer well woorthy noted whereof wee may gather good leſſon although ſo caried away purpoſe blaſpheme god yet notwithſtanding aſſoone haue neuer ſo little libertie immediatly ouerſhoote oure ſelues ho v pitie ſee man hee ſo fraughte euill aſſoone hath little libertie giuen hee raungeth one ſide wil hold right way gaddeth aſtray yea euen euer thinke certayne iob bene asked whether god ſought occaſion againſt handle ſo cruelly would haue anſwered rightuous yea hee woulde haue ſayde without hypocriſie yet notwithſtāding charged without cauſe haue ſtriued agaynſte god hee ſought vayne ſhiftes cōmeth paſſe bycauſe iob toſſed fro ſorrowe nowe ſo good ſtay himſelfe ought haue let v marke although man well grounded feare god leuer die vtter blaſphemie yet notwithſtanding cannot giue paſsions bridle ſcape v ſome euill woordes condemned ſpecially pinched aduerſitie paſsion ſorrow ſo vehemēt cānot ruled man skirmiſheth ſuch wiſe iuſtleth agaynſte god owne deſtruction ende sith ſee firſt let v conſider nature ſinfull frowarde ſo ye ſee one poynt haue marke followeth neceſsitie corrupted ſeing cānot thinke vpon god without wrōg iniurie furthermore alſo admoniſhed enter conſideration holde ſelues ſubiection whēſoener god ſcourgeth v ſay ala perceyue thou art diſpoſed afflict thy vvhen god hath graūted v grace poynt let v aſſure ſelues haue well profited inaſmuch ready obey receyue ſtripes roddes paciently howbeit god hath brought v ſo much reaſon muſt thē ſlip aſide rather ſay go thou art alredy boūd vnto thy god hath made thee willing receyue chaſtiſemēts ſendeth thee neuerthelater ſtil ſo many infirmity thee turning h • thou ſhouldeſt become impaciēt rebel againſt blaſpheme alſo without thinking let v learne ſo miſtruſt ſelues may ſtand vpon gard preuent theſe temptation done let v know notwithſtāding good wil haue yeeld ourſelues vnto god beare afflictiōs paciētly come yet paciēce perfect faultleſſe nūber euil imaginatiōs run heade although ſticke thē rather miſlike alwayes ſettle ſelues ſay behold god ſhall gouerne mee ſhall haue rule mee behooueth mee haue meekeneſſe hūble ſelf vnder euen though would trāple vnder feete yea although would thruſt downe depth bottōleſſe pit yet ought yeeld ſelf vnto vvhē come point yet many euill thought mindes againe ſpeake wil alwaies ſome ſlip v ſhall neuer haue wordes ſo well reſtreined ſtill ſomewhat filthineſſe naturall imaginatiō lapped therfore let v learne cōdemne ourſelues although haue bin pacient ſeeing iob reproued ſo greuouſly eliu ſentence let v ſure ſhall founde muche blameworthy ſpecially haue indeuored obey god yeelded honor belongeth vnto lo haue marke ſtreyne way iob condēned haue blaſphemed god ſhall become v ſo caried pacience v moſte cōmonly ſeene beare condemnation haue charged god though ſought vayne fonde clokings execute rigour vpon v certayne men confeſſe freely willingly god rightuous al puniſhments fully cōclude reſt vpō one ſhold ſay yea verely behold god tyrant vtter ſuch word horrible yet ſo meening meane wee glorifie god rightuouſneſſe acknowledging groūded vpon reaſon equitie right much wee charged executing tirānie vpō v graūt blaſphemies ſhall alwayes alike nother ſhall alwayes conſent iob ouerſhot himſelfe ſo far ſay reaſon god ſhould afflict howbeit forſomuch headineſſe paſsiōs caried away wee haue ſeene heretofore therfore holy ghoſt fayne cō demne text vvherfore let v ſure dānation ſhall greater quiet affliction fall grudging although mouth ſpeake worde yet ſo ful hartburning within play mule chaweth vpō bit whē haue ſuch bitterneſſe v againſt god aſmuche wee accuſed picking couert quarrel v puniſh v without cauſe touching ſaid heere god hath ſet feete ſtockes eliu rehearſeth iobs woordes iob ment god gaue libertie men hold offender ſtockes kind puniſhmēt make cōfeſſe would whither wil iob vſed ſayde cōpariſon ſaying god gaue meanes mayneteyne quarrell although good neuertheleſſe true iob al ſure himſelf god knew well ſome reaſon afflict yet ceaſſeth wonder chafe afflictiō though god preſſed ſore mā asked whether ment ſo hee woulde haue anſwered would haue vnſayde hande neuertheleſſe paſsions ſo vehement prouoked ſo ſore ſaying ſcaped ere hee ware nowe iob rebuked worde ſcaped vpon ſuddaine vnwares ſhal befal v wilfull hardharted haue ſpokē ſome worde vnaduiſedly alſo purpoſed long afore ſo wee bee willfully ſtubborne truely god warneth v therof ſheweth v haue done amiſſe therfore wil receyue warning giueth v follow ſtill owne wit naturall cōceytes pray ſhal thisſtubbornes cōdēne v hūdredfold ouerſight iob worthy maked wel whēſoeuer thinke god mighty power muſt take tirānical power ſay beholde god may v hee liſteth creature ſeeth nothing frailtie v yet notwithſtāding ceaſſeth vexe v without cauſe vvhen ſpeake faſhion onely outrage alſo curſed blaſphemie therefore let v match god mightypower rightfulneſſe ſaying true power god terrible vnto wholly diſmaide yet doth god ceaſſe rightuous doth thing rightfully thus thing haue gather vpon ſentence aſtoniſhed feele horrible torment may poſsible yet muſt therfore ſay god exceſsiue afflicting v ſhew able let v keepe v frō ſaying ſo thing let v conſider euen greateſt extremity feele god mainteyneth v ſo alayeth power conſumed firſte blow therwithall let v know although affliction ſore v warde heauy may bee yet notwithſtanding god ceaſſeth bee rightuous marke againe haue beare away ſentence wheras god watcheth ſteppes let v ſure doth without cauſe nowe let v come argument eliu vſeth reproue iob heerein thou ſhalt bee quit ſayth god greater thou preſent reaſon ſeemeth colde conuince iob decide preſent cace firſt al knoweth god greater men ſo mad cōfeſſe greatneſſe acknowledge vve ſee many fantaſticall heades deſpyſe god yet ſticke graunt god greater thā eliu thē ſayth new thing although ſame ſpeech cōmon yet notwithſtanding reaſon ſay god greater thā therfore followeth ſhall boote v mainteyne good cace ſeemeth rather eliu agreeth iob ſayd wit god vſeth ſuch rigour agaynſt howbeit abſolute power great able make part good maker poore earthen pot nothing infirmitie ſeemeth iob doth father abſolute power vpon god ſhould ſay hee liſteth agaynſt men without reaſon equitie let v marke behoueth v take ſentence otherwiſe woordes ſounde whereas mention made god greatneſſe ment go ioyntly euer truely muſt ſeparate vertues god owne proper men may well haue ſome vertues may bee taken ſo god vvhen wee ſpeake power iuſtice wiſedome goodneſſe ſpeake himſelfe thing inſeparable cannot ſeuered ſay cannot taken away ſo ioyned togither one cannot bee without god myghtie ſo hee alſo good myghtineſſe defeateth goodneſſe yet iuſtice therefore whereas eliu ſayeth heere god greater man meeneth greatneſſe onely power alſo greatneſſe power infinite iuſtice infinite wiſdome thing infinite compariſon therefore natural ſenſe ſtreyne ſee argument good put al men ſilence make ſtoupe humilitie may ſtand contention agaynſt god cauſe murmur affliction cānot ſuffer god handle v according hee ſeemeth haue done ynough much already demaūd ſo curiouſly god vſeth ſuch rigor againſt v cauſe wee thinke vppon god greatneſſe certaine man conſidered god would firſte brunt ſtay ſhet vp ſo woulde take libertie grudge reply wiſe therefore let v marke ouergreat exceſsiue affectiōs al murmuring ſuch like thing proceede wee know god ſpoyle maieſtie aſmuch lyeth v curſed thing ther none v lotheth yet ſee experience happeneth vnto v ere thinke thing fall would wiſh breake aray enter diſputation againſt god doubt would ſhould well put cace zeale good yet woulde bring god diſpoſe thing according liking happen otherwiſe yee ſee pacience whereof commeth bycauſe wee deſirous god ſhoulde giue v leaue cōmon familiarly beare ourſelues hand could ſhew thing ought go otherwiſe though wee cānot ſo yet notwithſtanding cānot cōtent v ſhorte muſte come poynt thing gouerned god prouidēce ſeemeth vnto v al ſhould go cōtrariwiſe ye ſee enter debate diſputation agaynſt god one wee would defeate greatneſſe bereeue right aſmuch v lieth thē without cauſe eliu vſeth principle agaynſte iob namely god greater thou wilt thou pleade agaynſt hereby warned firſt whenſoeuer much grieued affliction would haue thing go otherwiſe cannot abyde god ſhould gouerne v pleaſure one wee would firſt rob right afterwarde make fellow cōpanion ſo ſhould haue authoritie ſuperioritie ouer v intent ſhall bee ſo yet worthy blame therfore ſo muche ought wee ſory gather wittes v ſeing ſuch loftineſſe v cannot thorowly ſubdued glorifie god thing ſendeth v wold thing ſhould go cleane contrary taking vppon v taske god wee would deſire one would take greatneſſe marke one poynt furthermore lette v marke ynough v haue conceyued generally god greate behoueth v alſo conſider greateneſſe elſe wee ſhall wel ynoughe confeſſe god almightie hee created worlde ſo hath thing hande gouernaunce vvee ſhall neuer ſticke howbeeit theſe fleing confeſsions houering ayre ſhall fare neuer better thē go vvhat done behoueth v apply theſe miracle god vſe may come remēbrance ſort god ſhold great namely end may wholly giuē obey whatſoeuer may thinke good ſoeuer diſpoſe v may agree vnto acknowlege rightuous although toſſe v fro wee may alwaies ſtande ſtedfaſt beleefe ſendeth v thing rightful ye ſee thē acknowledging greatnes god graūting v thinketh good v generally creature know cōfeſſe god almighty leaſtwiſe earneſtly vnfainedly yet ſhal men neuer yeeld thēſelues obeying god neuer giue glory deſerueth knowing thēſelues god vvhē haue made cōpariſon perceyued nothing god ſurmounteth cā thinke hath infinite glory himſelf ſay know ſhal haue vaine truſt exalt ourſelues nother ſhal play wild coltes wont ſhall learne graūt god infinite greatneſſe know ourſelues nothing better expreſsing heereof eliu addeth god anſwerēth word importeth great ſubſtance eliu intendeth ſhew v cānot cōprehend al thing bicauſe god liſteth reuele thē vnto v effect thing ment behoueth v marke god manifeſteth himſelf vnto v part end ſhould left vntaught thing good expedient v neuertheleſſe knoweth capacitie according thervnto reueleth wil vnto v reſeruing meane whyle vnto himſelfe thing could cōprehend bicauſe paſſe vnderſtāding beare leſſon minde wee ſhall haue profited well one day behold god hath taken vpō charge office teach v therefore muſt negligent hearing ſeing ſo gracious v maſter let v wiſe ſchollers giue diligent heede ſayeth howbeit let v marke therwithall whē executeth office ſcholemaſter towards v open vnto v thing wold doubt wherof would inquiſitiue vvhat thē thing hee knoweth edifying ſay knoweth behoofe ſo behoueth v mark three thing one muſt haue eares opē receiue doctrine god teacheth v brute beaſts doth v honour apply indeuer profite vnder thus ye ſee firſt poynt vve muſte wretched papiſts would know nothing ſay daungerous matter inquire god ſecrets true muſt come lowlineſſe reuerence ought wee therefore haue eares ſtopped deafe whē god ſpeaketh v let v alwaies learne ready willing receyue whatſoeuer ſayde ſet forth vnto v name god thus muche cōcerning firſt point secōdly let v mark god wil ſhew v thing muſt content ſelues paule ſayeth firſt corinthian wit know parte ſee glaſſe darkely yet come day full reuelatiō although goſpell called brightneſſe noone day yet notwithſtanding ſame referred meaſure god inlighteneth v ſufficiētly ſee face lord ieſus chriſt behold transfigured ſame howſoeuer worlde go wee ſee whiche prepared againſt latter day behoueth v increaſe cōtinually fayth faith preſuppoſeth thing yet hiddē according haue meaſure fayth scripture ſayeth haue meaſure perfection thus yee ſee howe haue beare minde faithfull preſent lyfe ought content themſelues ſome taſte god know ſome portion wee haue fond deſire ſay know thing ignorant nothing mad wiſedome muche better v bee ſtarke fooles therefore let v marke faithfull muſt cōtent themſelues reueled vnto far greater better wiſedome inquiſitiue thing without exception marke ſecond point third god holding v point niggardly ſhewe v bicauſe knoweth conuenient v therefore let v marke well god teacheth v oure edification vvhat meaſure fayth doctrine holy ſcripture rule god knoweth expedient ſaluatiō men neede cō plaine may know thing conteyned holie scripture haue declared vntoo dayly sermon men know neede cōplayne though vnderſtanding ynough looke whatſoeuer good conuenient v lorde hath declared vnto v ſith wee ſee god hath cōmaunded worde brought vnto v would hide thing frō v might bee ſaluation haue ſo much thankes giue diſcloſing himſelfe ſo familiarly vnto v haue wherwith cōtent ſelues rather curious wee ſee many deſirous bee ſearching meaſure papiſtes alſo haue ſame ſo one ſide ſayde muſt bee inquiſitiue god ſecrets vnder colour reiected al holy ſcripture ſide fooliſh curioſitie ſeeking thing apperteyned vnto full fond dotage ſay ſuch thing howe ſuche thing done ſhort nothing contented inſomuch whole holy scripture better vnto thā apce aſhamed ſpew diueliſh blaſphemie haue holy scripture ynough v muſt haue ſecrete myſteries god hath reſerued church vvhervppon haue forged like mahumet ſayde alcorā great perfection ſo alſo pope ſayeth certayne ſecretes reſerued vnto beſides holy scripture vvhat ſhame yet notwithſtanding warned heere cauſe lord hath fitted doctrine capacitie meaſure behoueth v cōtēted bring thither wādring luſtes ſay goeth wee therefore let v heare god ſpeake let v open eye receiue ſheweth telleth v worde agayne come point let v hold v quiet ſheweth v ſort muſt put truſt maner muſt liue maner muſt woorſhip hath ſhewed v well lette v ſettle ſelues wholly bee contented ſheweth v holy scripture knoweth vnderſtāding bruck alſo thing hath declared vnto v darke ſo honor receyue lowlineſſe ſo mad ouerweening deſire vnderſtand haue hidden frō v graunt rightuous except ſhewe v cauſe according ſee many ſay tuſh beleeue paſſeth mine vnderſtanding thou vile ade dareſt thou blaſpheme god ſort bicauſe giueth thee account doings diſdayneſt thou forbeare thing whiche hidden frō thee bicauſe thou canſt cōprehend reaſon thy beaſtlineſſe lette v puffed vp ſuche pride might make v ruſh againſt god let v content ourſelues declared heere wayting paciently greate day wherein thing know parte taſt behold glaſſe ſhall ſhewed vnto v face face full perfection let v fal face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue done wee may craue pardon alſo beſeech renewe v holy ſpirite clenſe v fleſhly affection foraſmuch nothing vanitie v cannot ſtray right way wee followe naturall inclination may pleaſe redreſſe guyde v hande vnto end life may pleaſe graunt c cxxiiij sermon third vpon xxxiiij chapter 14 god vvill ſpeake tvvice men heare 15 dreame viſion night vvhen ſleepe vpon men reſte theyr bed 16 openeth eare men ſealeth chaſticement vpon 17 ende dravve man backe vvorke hydethe pryde men eliu goeth forward matter begonne alredy laſt ſermon wit god yeeldeth account dooings ſayings vnto mortall men haue marke haue declared already namely eliu treateth heere doctrine god ought cleere eaſie vnto v god proteſteth prophet eſay ſpeaketh vnto v couertly nother naught ſayeth ſeeke worde darke vnto v commeth ſelfe blindneſſe dull wit doctrine god hath ſet forth vnto v whiche conteyned holy ſcripture rightly named light eliu therfore ſpeaketh determination god maketh owne ſecrete purpoſe hath bin ſayde god ſetting forth woord vnto v hath regarde capacitie whiche ſlender meane reſerueth thing himſelfe wee could cōprehend yet bicauſe profitable ſaluatiō god taketh pleaſure ignorance bicauſe knoweth good v therfore behoueth v contēted meaſure giueth v tary till day full diſcouery come time ſhal know thing hidden vvherfore let v profite according ſhal pleaſe god giue v power vntil behold thing opēly darke vnto v ye ſee effect haue gather text namely treating worde god heare dayly haue taught v ſecrets keepeth himſelfe wil haue diſcloſed vnto men yet bycauſe able cōceyue ſayde heretofore god anſwere wordes ſay men nothing muſt preſume call god account workes ſo ſhould make thē priuie worketh one ſort addeth god ſpeake twyce men ſhall heare worſe v many ſentēces cōcerning god ſheweth effect wherof notwithſtanding reaſon vnknowen although god ſpeake mouth yet ſomtimes heard wit matter cōcerneth thing men cō prehēd yet buried frō till later day true preſent ſentēce expounded diuerſly ſome vnderſtād god wil ſpeake ſay wil ſpeake word behoueth v reſt vpō two come againſt vouchſafe regard ſo men muſt thinke repeale god ordinance ſhal alwayes ſtande vnimpeached true touching elius matter haue told already behoueth v continue thing ſawe laſte ſermon namely god yeeld account wordes ſo eliu graunteth libertie ſpeake ſay hee yea euen ſuche wiſe men may carpe haue bene alſo whiche referre eliu addeth namely god ſpeaketh vntoo men viſions nyght ſleepe troubleth alſo ſpeaketh chasticements ſeemeth vnto two manner ſpeaking vnto v god vſeth ſo ſometime reueleth himſelf inſpirations ſometimes alſo toucheth v hande nothing purpoſe cōſtrayned ſenſe furthermore neede beate braynes much ſeking diuerſities expoſitiōs ſeing naturall ſenſe manyfeſt vnto v therefore let v follow haue declared alredy god ſhal ſpeake twice yea yet vnderſtoode thus know eliu ment ſay nowe remayneth apply ſame inſtruction howe firſte knowing owne ſlenderneſſe cauſe mē take ſo highly vpon ſeeke ſearch ſuch ſort nothing may eſcape bicauſe thinke themſelues able ynough finde thing man thorowly well tamed ſuch ſorte chalenge nothing himſelfe hee ſo prowde loftie ſearch god ſecretes farre meaſure intent may take profit text ſpecially firſt let v humble ſelues yea euen acknowledging vnderſtanding ſmall groſſe marke one poynte ſide let v conſider alſo god ſecrete iudgementes dreadfull dungeon wayes incomprehenſible lawfull men wade far muſt content themſelues declareth ye ſee ſecōd poynt haue marke whē thinke vpon highneſſe god ought rauiſhed honoring cōclude muſt take vpon v able know cōprehend al whither go wee crepe heere vpon earth know far ſurmoūteth heauēs ſeing ſo let v honor ſecret iudgements aſſuring ſelues hee alwayes haue authoritie ſpeake vtter liſteth mauger al ſpeke againſt yea ſpeaketh twice ſay ſheweth pleaſure men ſhall know nothing bicauſe rude conceyue thing one worde god hath determined purpoſe ſhal dayly ſee one thing yet withſtāding new ſeeke yea ſtill dazeled euen end yeere ten although haue ſeene one thing oftē yet reaſon ſhall hiddē frō thē vvere pride v ſufficiētly confirmed vnto v experience wee neuer come reaſon cōpulſion wil alwayes nedes ſelfwiſe euē though ignorāce ſhew ſelfe ynough much neuertheleſſe without cauſe bee warned text god wil haue determinatiōs buried hid vve ſee effect dayly know ſay ſauing wonderfull thing behooueth v bridle ſelues wayting till lord reuele greater perfectiō ſhal till bereft mortall fleſh thus ye ſee haue marke according article haue touched already let v note alſo ſpeaking iudgements god haue hiddē bicauſe behoofe haue full knowledge thē yet ſayd 62 pſalm god ſpeketh dauid proteſteth beare twice namely might mercie god treating god wōderful iudgemēts thing learn word brought remembrance ſet v cōtinually one ſide god maketh v feele myghtie power end ſhould feare walk according ſide hee giueth v mercie ende ſhould take cōfort ioy vvhat learne daily god word maſter behoueth v ſubiect muſte liue luſt god muſt reigne ouer v lawe bridle may taught vnder thus firſt poynt ſerue god know requireth alloweth ſecond wee knowe father ſauiour end put whole truſt howe ſhall knowe grounding ſelues vpon mere mercie knowing nothing death damnation v acknowledging hee hath drawen v oute deathe owne meere goodneſſe lord ieſus chriſts ſake thus concerning ſecond poynt two thing wherein behoueth v cōfirmed muſt reſort reſuge alſo forſomuche mercie ſet v dayly ſhoulde doubt wil receyue v texte dauids ſpeaketh thing kept hidden knowledge thing god intendeth declare vnto v teache v therefore ſayeth god hath ſpoken ſay god hath ſo manifeſted ſpeaking men ought doubt reply agaynſte whiche ſayeth haue hearde twyce ſayeth hee herein betokeneth inough haue heard god glaunce behooueth v minde thing without ceaſing hee ſpeaketh although ſpake yet muſte let doctrine ſlip ſettle throughly oure remembrance learne print heart thinke vpon early late bycauſe memory ſhorte ſee nowe dutie faithfull apply thēſelues throughly hearing thing god ſheweth worde ſet whole minde vpon aſſuring themſelues god wyll gyue knowlege thing telleth promiſeth welfare marke one poynt howbeeit heerewithall let v keepe ſelues ſeeking let v couet wiſer god haue v bee howe may bee learning ſchoole reſerue ſecrete iudgements himſelfe let v ignorant thing wil haue knowne vnto v vntill haue taken v world example ſayde vnto v god gouerneth thing prouidence eliu ſpeaketh ſame purpoſe yee ſee god diſpoſeth creature holdeth thing hand nothing happeneth worlde chaunce thing according doctrine gyuen v holy scripture behooueth v receyue without gaynſaying nowe wee inquire howe woulde god whenſoeuer hee worketh ſhoulde yeelde v reaſon doings would enter diſputation checke agaynſt paſſe boundes ſee theſe toades full poyſon ſpewe blaſphemies agaynſt prouidence god ſaying god diſpoſe thing author ſinne euil bee fathered vpon lo heere curſed thing behoueth v holde ſelues within cōpaſſe holy scripture gyueth v bycauſe wee perceyue reaſon god doth thing therefore thinke ſtraunge behooueth v ſtay like alſo holie scripture ſayeth god choze whome pleaſed making worlde▪ forſoke reſt good reaſon ſhould receiue reuerence acknowledge ſaluatiō proceedeth free goodnes god foraſmuch hath chozen v forlorne damned lumpe furthermore vpon ſayd poynt fall flittering ouer high ſpeculations ſhall confounded rightly vvhy ſo therein woulde know god hath graunted v aſmuch fight agaynſt thinke ſuch outrage ſhal ſcape vnpuniſhed thus ye ſee howe ought practize ſentence ſayde god ſhall ſpeake twyce without heard ſay without beeing vnderſtoode bicauſe wit man weake let v come eliu addeth ſayeth men bee layde downe ſleepe rest aſleepe god ſpeaketh openeth eares purpoſe withdraw owne workes tame hyde pryde men ſay caſte downe burie elſe ſeeke diſcipline inſtruction chastizing hee ſee hardeharted receyue playne doctrine inſtruction whiche giueth hee fayne ſtryke vpon tame roddes inforce taught truth effect thing treated truly eliu ſpeaketh owne time haue tolde already hee people whiche god chozen communicate lawe vnto hee thoſe whome wee haue hearde ſpeake iob himſelfe tyme moyſes thing vncertayne yet ſtrangers church god knowledge giuen extraordinary manner aſmuch pleaſed god inſpyre cauſe hee ſayeth god inſpyreth men euen dreames aſleepe god doth plucke eare gyue warning thinke vppon true god inſpireth v alſo although heare worde inſtruction haue holy scripture reade yet doth hee ceaſſe warne v ſtill giue v many heartbitings manye ſummoning call v backe himſelfe gone aſtray ſee howe men bury ſayde knowledge ſecke meanes forget god god commeth ſearch within v therefore feele pricking thought ſtirre v vp let v vnderſtande god putteth v remembraunce himſelfe bycauſe wee inclined forget become brutiſhe specially nyghtetyme alone wittes gathered v wander heere come deepe thought wey v ſo farre euen make v ſweate tremble el bee ſuch diſquietneſſe mind though vpō racke god worketh cace ſummoneth v bicauſe ſeeth fugitiues like yong boy leaueth father houſe runneth abroade blowing feather winde god ſeing v run ſo aſtray calleth v home viſions night true ſhall ſuche eliu iob eliphas others haue help wanted wit word god preached v heare thus doth god reuele himſelfe vnto v bicauſe haue law prophet goſpell hāds eares cōtinually beaten doctrine hath willed preached vnto v therefore muſtnot looke taught maner thoſe nother ſcripture preaching yet neuertheleſſe ſee god woorketh ſort ſome men ſhorte haue marke heere although god ſende v ſuche viſions auncient father muſt diſcōtented grudge great vnthākfulneſſe bycauſe hath pleaſed god cōmunicate himſelfe vnto v meane fitter v ſome curious folk demaunde god appeareth heauē time paſte thing perfourmed ſpake moyſes namely would ſpeake prophet viſiōs figure dreames bicauſe day haue fully reueled vnto v vvere ſuperfluous thing god ſhould appeare vnto v former time ſeeing hath giuen v another meane deſpyſe woorde haue handes ſufficiently fully perfectly inſtructed let v learne bee contented faſhion god hath ordeyned inſtruct v let v note appearing viſions vnto aūcient father bicauſe yet lawe written elſe appearing vntoo prophetes bicauſe needefull haue larger declaration thing yet darke nowe god truthe cleare manifeſt ynough behoueth v take viſions time paſte confirmation fayth knowing ſprang ſame fountayne therfore let v walke ſimplicitie whiche god willeth v holde marke one poynt ſecond let v cōſider god goodneſſe hath giuē v worde writing rayſed vp men expound ſtill toucheth v ſtirreth v vp inwardly holy ſpirite giuing v remorces inſpirations therfore let v conſider care whiche hath ſaluation ſeing draweth v ſo ſweetely vnto meanes ye ſee effect haue gather vpon ſtreyne eliu addeth god ſealeth inſtruction men chastiſing hand article well worthy borne minde ſhewed v god muſt fayne ſpeake vnto v many ſtrokes hand ſay ſo gratious vnto v allure v gently woorde ſeeth gentleneſſe auayleth hee vſeth greater vehemencie tame v rebuketh v ſinnes maketh v afrayde citeth v iudgement end ſhould beware reſtrayne ourſelues beaten downe vnder cōfeſſe wretchedneſſe craue pardon ſorie ſo might clenſe v fault hath vſed thoſe meanes ſay hath laboured bring v backe ſweteneſſe homelineſſe woorkes vvee continue ſtill ſame wee afore become wilfull hardehartedneſſe therfore fayne lift vp mighty hand rūne vpon v ſtrike v hāmer vpon anuilde ſeeth v ſo hardharted word enter eares eliu ment ſay true ſayde heeretofore god openeth men eares yea truely know well god worketh ſecret power v whē ſendeth v inſpirations ſpokē addeth bicauſe would fayne ſo ſotted ſhoulde none life v giue ourſelues making good cheere vvee ſee howe men ſhunne god preſence aſmuch ſeeke meanes runne aſtray vanity god openeth eares toucheth v ſuch wiſe wee bee compelled bethinke oure ſelues theefe hardened wickedneſſe could finde heart remembraunce iuſtice aboliſhed ſhall notwithſtanding fayle haue pricking hartbitings ſling withall whereof commeth euen bycauſe god openeth eares howbeeit let v marke double opening eares god woorketh v ſometime openeth eares ende wee ſhoulde bee inforced perceyue hee ſpeaketh yet wee ceaſſe bee ſtubborne ſtill refuze doctrine correction hee giueth v ſo wee receyue chaſtizement hande amende v opening oure eares better god ſofteneth hart ſo willingly receyue ſayings giue heede yeelde oure ſelues wholly doctrine vvhen ſayd god openeth mennes eares vnderſtood men indifferently yeeld themſelues teachable vnto diſpoſed obey hee ſpeaketh well reprobate god child reprobate ſhall haue ſome opening eares inſomuch ſhal fayne perceyue ſpite teeth god ſpeaketh vnto howbeeit foraſmuche ſhake thought thruſt vnder foote continue alwayes deafe meane whyle good men take profite know ſtriuing agaynſte god whereas eliu addeth god ſealeth instruction ſpeaketh ſuche ſo dull vppon ſpurre ſo ſtubborne god ſubdue woorde therefore ſuche ſo ſhake doctrine muſte bee forced heare god ſpeake faſhion witte god muſt faine beate teach harde ſtripes ſhewe force mayſter yee ſee howe ſtreyne ought vnderſtoode therewithall let v marke well manner ſpeach eliu vſeth god ſigneth ſealeth instruction chasticements heereby ſheweth chaſticementes ſerue make inſtruction authoritie men reiect make count could except inſtructions god worde matched chaſticements god ſhould onely beate without ſending knowledge thing therefore behoueth teache v beating v father beate childe dragge heare head treade vnder feete yet ſpeake neuer worde child ſhall vtterly diſmayde bicauſe hee knoweth father meeneth choler come vpon ſo childe ſhall neuer better father ſay thou naughty boy ſee thou haſt done thervpon beate childe perceyueth father inſtruction profite learneth know fault hath obeyed ought haue done behold ſayeth bicauſe receyued father ſingle woorde hee ſealeth inſtiuction gaue mee euen ſo dealeth god men graūteth men grace haue truth preached vnto reade holy scripture giueth remorces hartbitings ſpake paule ſheweth ſeconde romaynes wee ſelues feele ſufficiently nature▪ man hath inwarde record owne conſcience god reueleth vnto men ſo farre forth needefull make vnexcuſable therewithall foraſmuche ſeeth men ſuffer themſelues bee taught hande ſtoppe theyr eares elſe count doctrine trifle make mocke warning hee giueth foraſmuche men forget themſelues ſort ſtandeth god hande ſeale doctrine make full authoritie ſo whē men ſcourged may acknowledge themſelues ſay wel ſee god ſheweth power bicauſe haue honored reuerēced maieſtie ought therfore fayne know perforce conſider inſtructions better haue done cauſe ſmitten miſchiefe light vppon mee ere thought bicauſe made ſelfe beleeue might ſcape god hand holdeth mee faſte ſhet vp thereby ſee doctrine ratified vnto mee ſay made ſuche fayne thinke ſpite teeth honor better haue done let v learne whenſoeuer god afflicteth v ſendeth v chaſticemēts muſt conſider ſame ſeales ſetteth vpon warning whiche giuen v afore euidence vnſealed men doubt alledged ſhall bee credited bicauſe autētik haue ſeale doubte ſufficient inſtrument muſt receiued vvherfore let v marke god worketh ſame maner afflicting v wherby ſealeth doctrine althogh goſpel preched among v law ought elſe conſcience paynim turkes haue yet ſufficient warning god wil knowledge ynoughe wee choke owne wilfulneſſe ſeeing ſpeaketh vnto v ſo familiarly bothe lawe prophetes ſpecially mouth ieſus chriſt ſide ſo hardharted ſtubborne wee receyue thing woonder lorde ſtrike v many blowes inforce v come vnto therfore let v ouergreeued oure affliction manie men turmoyle god afflcteth neuer knowne word god knowledge haue muſt needes bee ſolde dearlyer vnto v bycauſe god hath ſpoken ſo vnto v allured v owne holy mouth drawe backwarde voutſafe go forwarde one ſteppe muſt needes ſmitten double nothing elſe v kicking wincing lette v learne receyue chaſticements god ſendeth v quiet minde conſider afflicting v vaine vvhy ſo let v marke whither doctrine haue bin ſuche authoritie amōg v ought ſay whether haue bene teachable meeke followe oure ſhepherde ſheepe lambes aſſoone god ſpeaketh ought print worde harte ſticke vnto either go wipe elſe eares deaf elſe goeth one eare seeing one ſort v haue giuen reuerence god woorde another ſort haue ſtryued openly againſt third mock ſeeing ſo ill receyued hand god muſt fayne ſeale affliction yee ſee thē aduerſities god ſendeth v ſeales howbeit end chaſticementes hard painfull v nature may made amiable vnto v let v marke well whiche eliu ſayeth heere namely god intent draw men frō owne work hyde pryde heere expreſſeth god ſealing doctrine affliction onelye reſpecteth magnifying word might haue full maieſtie alſo therwithall procureth mennes ſaluation end therfore god ameth afflicting v ought ſuger ſeazon bitterneſſe whiche otherwiſe ſheweth ſelfe affliction yee ſee god affliction comberſome beare▪ yea truely▪ ſhunne al thing miſlike morouer god wrath terrible thing vnto v nowe whenſoeuer god puniſheth v token angry v therefore cannot bee afrayde greeued diſtreſſed howbeeit god ſweeteneth al ſhewing v ende intendeth hee meeneth frame v owne hande ſeeking make v followe obey thus yee ſee eliu addeth ſaying god intendeth drawemen theyr owne woorkes ſpeaketh workes meeneth generally thing men take hand▪ thing raſhly owne heade knowe god hath created v labour hee haue v bee ydle vnoccupied euerye man ſhould apply himſelf able ſhould conſider wherin may ſerue god neighbour euery v imploy himſelfe therein according abilitie ſhall haue receyued therefore god afflicteth v hee meeneth drawe v work ſay make v vtterly good nothing true brought low ſickneſſe armes legges good brokē men muſt fayne ſerue v worlde muſte combered v wee able doe ſeruice yet doth god draw v vtterly worke pacience worke god eſteemeth aboue thing ſhort god draweth v work afflicting v work ment foliſh enterpriſes men take hand god let v alone laye brydle necke howe bold practize nothing ſticke v ſo muche wee would remoue heauen earth muſt ſay haue ſuch way go vve ſee adayes prince take ſuch enterpriſes vpon thing hande would make newe world pride ſheweth ſelf thoſe great men fayleth alſo leſſer ſorte theſe play scorpiōs wrythe tayles caſt abroade poyſon none v al neuer ſo mean vndertaketh thing auenture therefore needfull god ſhould bring v back maner ſay ſhould pluck v back oure raſhe doings ſending affliction vntoo v ſo ſayd haue good cauſe good comfort god afflicteth v ſeing ſo ſtubborn nature neuer come freewill would become v ſhould reſtreyned force therfore conſidering men nature go cleane contrarie god fling abroad like wilde beaſts let v vnderſtand god hath neede repreſſe v ſith know let v giue glorie ſuffreth v runne like wild colt doeth continually brydle v vnder obedience yea alſo tame v affliction ſeeth great headineſſe v lo haue beare awaye ſtreyne let v marke eliu addeth ende namely god intendeth hyde pryde men herein ſheweth welſpring enterpriſes pryde v vvhat cauſe men leape ſort fling thēſelues aire make ſuch kicking wincing euē fooliſhe ouerweening blindeth men knewe themſelues would tame ynough take ſelues maruellouſe wight knowe borne created obey god vntill ſuch time pryde abated v ſurely wil ouerbold run aſtray therfore god intend withdraw v enterpriſes behoueth firſt cure diſeaſe pryde reigneth much v expreſſe mentiō made hiding pride ynough bury end may ſhew ſelf eliu vſeth ſame ſimilitude oftentimes vſe towards men make aſhamed man ſhuld ſay go hide thy ſelflike villeine one made great countenance brauerie ſhould deface ſuch reproches durſt ſhewe himſelfe ſhould fame bury himſelf houſe lo ſort pride hampered ſame ſort doth god worke towards v whereas would faine play wiſe men folly bewrayeth ſelf god ſuffereth pryde always concealed bewrayeth itſelf vvel perceiued doth god hee afflicteth v intent meken v howbeit doth ſhame ſay buffeteth v therewithal worketh v ſuch reproche wee perceiue owne diſhoneſtie faine goe hide ſelues like leude lozels went exalt themſelues beyond meaſure reaſon ye ſee eliu ment therfore god couereth pryde men ſheweth hee beareth downe thruſteth vnderfote yea euen ſuch wiſe men aſhamed wheras erſt bene bold thinking themſelues able worke wonder let v marke god ſheweth v ſingular fauor ſpeaketh v ſeeing ſhould wretched brute beaſts taught agayne hee ſendeth v hartbitings nip v quicke doe v good afterward afflicted hand let v aſſure ſelues bicauſe wee bee hard ſtubborne therefore muſt bee tamed wild beaſtes yet notwithſtāding let v conſider al thē god ſeales wherby heleth ratifieth warning giuen v word therefore let v make much receiue paciently ſeing mean procureth welfare ſaluatiō ſo let v deſire nothing life long ſhewe ſelues true child towardes giue ouer oure ſelues wholly obedience ſeruice nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledging oure faultes praying make v feele better haue done much hee hath choſen v houſholde let v deſire wiſe guided hande ſimplicitie reuerēce aſmuch hath kindled light worde amongs v may gouerned vnto end mynds maynteined ſuch pureneſſe ought ſo may day day growe increaſe knowledge worde vntill come behold glorie fully perfectly bee tranſfigured ſame althoughe behoue v paſſe many battels fele vnto wretchedneſſe ſubiecte world yet notwithſtanding may vphild alwayes power get vpper hand al temptation intent goodneſſe may ſtrengthen v walk obedience may pleaſe graunte grace c cxxv sermon fourth vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon xvj xvij verſes vpon text added heere 18 plucketh backe ſoule graue life ſhould come ſvvorde 19 chaſtizeth man vvith greefe vpon bed breaketh bone vvith chaſtizementes▪ 20 ſoule refuſeth bread life pleaſant meate 21 fleſhe conſumed ſo ſeene bone alſo vvhiche ſeene doe clatter 22 ſoule dravveth graue life vnto follovve death 23 eloquent meſſanger one among thouſande ſhevve man rightuouſneſſe 24 god hath pitie ſayth deliuer end go dovvne pitte haue found attonement 25 fleſhe ſhall come agayne freſhe chyldes ſhee ſhall returne dayes youth ſaw yeſterday god muſt bee faine drawe v force fooliſhe enterpriſes bycauſe naturally wee bee ſo preſumptuous ther nothing would medling god ſhould warne v myld thruſt forth ourſelues ouerhaſtily inough ther foliſh boldneſſe men held awe great violence man ſhould tie vp wild beaſt cheynes god therfore muſt faine deale v ſhewed v text man wil neuer turne away enterpriſes excepte god ſubdue mayne blowes cauſe thereof euen pride hath bene ſayd alreadie therfore vntill pryde man nature beaten downe thruſt vnder foote need always roiſting ſtarting one ſide yea flinging away like wild beaſts ſo let v marke wel chefeſt thing haue doe affliction learne humble oure ſelues wee bee ſo fooliſh ouerbold take vpon v god gyueth v leaue doe wee walke vnder gouernment asking counſell alwayes mouth holding ourſelues ſtil cōmaunded chalenging aught ſtrength power yee ſee leſſon behoueth v remember earely late god afflicteth v eliu expreſſeth yet thing whiche haue touched wit god procureth welfare ſayde meanes humbling v bycauſe deſtruction vndoing mē ſo puffed vp exalt themſelues lauful thē therfore meanes drawe oute ditch kepe ſtumbling deadly fal god hold back affliction ſo ye ſee cauſe w • e fall intoo graue god afflicteth v therewithall eliu ſheweth v howe harſhe medicine hee ſayeth conſumeth oure fleſhe ſo wee haue ſhape man like vntoo deade men taken earthe oure bone doe clatter without wee ſo much take breathe continuall tormente ſo wee haue releaſe god perſecuteth v ſuch extremitie thus ſheweth god firſt blowe winne thing mennes hande deſired wit ſhould knowe themſelues wretched full infirmity vpon ſtoup vnto muſt faine ouercom ſtrong hand continual torment elſe neuer yeelde ſubmit ſelues vnto behold two poyntes wee haue marke touching firſte let v learne beare affliction patiently ſith wee ſee ſerue v medicine ſalues ſmall thing v bee drawne graue theſe wordes concerne onely bodily death whiche paſſeth awaye alſo ſimilitude euerlaſting damnation termed heere graue pit readie fall breake armes legges breake neckes alſo periſhe euer wiped booke life cut kingdome heauen lo ſtate pride bringeth v ſo long flicker ſorte ayre thinke wee haue anye ſtrength ſelues build thervpon fancie ſay ſo long poſſeſſed ſuche fooliſhe preſumtiō always ready ſtumble periſh god hauing pitie v ſendeth ſuch remedie knoweth conuenient afflicteth v beateth v roddes grudge pacient god doth ſo chaſtiſe v extreme vnthankfulneſſe ſuffer god remedie deſtruction draw v frō let v mark well holy ghoſt ment make god chaſticemēts ſweet amiable v end ſhould beare them▪ quietly ſent v marke one poynt verely ſeeme ſtraunge fleſhely reaſon oure fleſhely reaſon ſaye coulde god prouide better meane oure welfare tormenting v ſort behoued ſende v death might call v vnto life surely incredible manner proceeding man debate according owne reaſon thinke fooliſhneſſe god ſhoulde kill v pardoning v affliction signes wrath wee knowe diſeaſes meſſengers death ſorrowes whiche conceiue drownings v lord ſendeth v ſorrows ſickneſſes tormentes holdeth v vpon racke till till wee faynte ſuche wiſe life draweth graue theſe word concerne ſmall affliction accuſtomed concern god ſending v ſo great extremitie remayneth hope v muſt god caſt v bottome death end drawe v againe ſo worketh muſt pleade againſt ſhall alwayes haue worſe end ſtaf doubt cauſe holy ſcripture ſayeth ordinarie maner kil quicken bring graue raiſe life let v vnderſtād god intendeth heere exerciſe oure obedience trying v vttermoſt ſo wee indure ſo much drawe breath ſeeme bee vtterly choked therefore lorde bringeth v point end know whether wholly whether wee abyde gouerned hand howſoeuer world go▪ tempted trouble greefes let ſentence come mynde comfort v withall behold ſayde god bringing men graue intendeth drawe againe conſuming fleſhe hee mindeth reſtore tormenting extremitie hee purpoſeth comfort bring reſt seeing ſo let v take hold comfort let ſuffize v aſſuage ſorrowes let v hart although ſeeme vtterly forlorne let v alwayes paſſe ſtrength doctrine let v learne raiſe vp ſelues euen wee bee caſt downe hell thus ye ſee haue beare mynde afterwarde eliu maketh ſo long deſcription god chaſtizements ſhew v dreadfull wrath alſo profitable leſſon v v thinketh greatnes god wrath ſpoken holy ſcripture ſayd ſong moyſes knoweth greatneſſe thy wrath vndoubtedly although god wrath bee fire conſumeth thing yet notwithſtanding thinke vpon ouerpaſſe tolde v sermon reade goodly text touched nother doth mā reſt vpon much make accoūt god iuſtice take ſport ought marke wel counſell giuen v holy ghoſt like text ſaide tha god breaketh men bone ſay vſeth ſo great violence remaineth ſtrength al vnconſumed fleſh waſteth conſumeth away ſo remaineth image death man ſo continually tormented like deade man without cauſe ſet afore v ende waken v god vttereth iudgementes againſt v make v feele ſinnes ſhould better thinke v thoſe tormentes terrible expreſſed according alſo wee ſee howe holie ſcripture vſeth many compariſons behalfe vvhy doth likē god lion breketh brozeth thing teeth plucketh peeces pawes attribute ſuch crueltie vnto god cōuenient humble v bycauſe dull knowe feare god ſtande awe puniſhments ſendeth vpon ſuch lift vp ſelues againſt ende wee may bee poſſeſſed ſuch dulneſſe holy ſcripture ſetteth foorth god likeneſſe lion commeth vpon v teeth pawes make v vnderſtand intendeth ſhewe himſelfe contrarie vnto men terrour aboue comparable yee ſee vſe ought apply thing ſayd ſuch warning ought ro ſerue v aforehand alſo ſometimes trouble god falleth ſo vpon v behoueth v put thing vre ſpoken heere end may knowe firſt haue bene ſo delt withal yea vndoubtedly notable place wher ſayde god conſumeth • man fleſhe bruſeth breaketh ſwalloweth vp hee killeth men quicken ſo although anger dreadful vnto v viſiteth v rigor driuen feele thing conteined heere yet notwithſtanding hee cheereth v hope ſaluation mean bring v vnto life vvherefore ſeeing god giueth v hope firſt haue bene ſo delt withal hee hath handled ſeruantes ſorte tymes let v ſuffer ſelues bee ſwallowed vp ſorrowe ſet gulfe truely wee ſee eliu following hath beene ſhewed foreſayde ſong moyſes ſpeaketh ſo without cauſe marke howe ſentence ought ſerue v double vſe firſt reſt wee muſt take time bethinke v howe dreadfull god wrath ende wee may walke feare carefulneſſe ſubmit oure ſelues vnder hand ſeconde muſt much afrayd god viſiteth v ſo roughly knowing hath delt ſame ſort towardes thoſe whoſe ſaluation hath procured let v thinke ſtrange ſhould deale ſo v let v learne faſhion ourſelues like vnto thoſe haue wayted fully comforted god hand bin heauineſſe yea euen bene ſwalowed vp ſorowe therewithall let v marke alſo long continuance affliction wherof eliu ſpeaketh heere hee ſayth god afflicting man ſuch wiſe hee ſhall ſeeme vtterly forlorne ſhall one brunt▪ releeue againe byandby contrariwiſe layeth hande vpon thoſe whome hee intendeth afflict hee maketh heuier heuier ſo much poore creature ſore tormented day ſhall bee double morrowe afterward bee ſo increaſed ſhall ſeeme haue nother ende meaſure ſhall continue ſo long ſhal paſſe hūdred dethes god ſhall ſeeme releeue litle ſhall wee deliuered affliction immediately haue felt muſt increaſed good pleaſure god ſhould fight againſte many deathes truely ſeemeth right harde vnto v howebeit let v marke rough horſe muſt haue rough ryder much wee bee tough wood behoueth v haue hard wedge hard ſtrokes beetle true think ourſelues rebel againſt god▪ conſider thing without flattering ourſelues ſhall find nouriſhing wilful ſtubborneſſe vs▪ ſmal common thing chawe vppon brydle ſuche wiſe againſt god although affliction increaſe yet ceaſſe gnaſhe teeth ſtill playe wild beaſts ſort pretend ſome token humilitie bee ſo fickle day morrowe quite head long man hild baye vndoubtedly ſay haue offended god behoueth mee turne newe leaf hee onely make countenaunce afore men thorough hypocriſie willing amende alſo thinke himſelf vtterly chaunged wicked affection god deliuer morrow morning become worſe hee leaſt wiſe bad see plight therfore let v think ſtrange god ſhould ſo increaſe ſtrypes ſee wee wonne ſuch ſturdineſſe v muſt fayne correct v long behoueth worke roughly like diſeaſe rooted peraduenture diſeaſed perſon thinke ſelfe rid ſoone hath taken ſome ſirup ſome pill hath bin let bloud ſay ſeeme vnto throughly whole roote diſeaſe yet plucked vp therfore muſt fain take ſome verie harſhe bitter medicine bee kepte diet abyde vnder phiſitions hande moneth twaine yea whole yeare euen ſame maner muſt god purge v diuerſe remedy make long ere hee cure v bycauſe vice pryde rooted ouerdeepely v entered euen intoo maree bone ſo infected ſoundneſſe v al corrupted till god renewe againe thus yee ſee mention made long continuing affliction till yea god muſt faine vſe diuerſe remedy afflicting v alwayes one faſhion ſending v ſome time one kynde ſometimes another thing let v aſſure ourſelues doth without great cauſe taketh pleaſure tormenting poore creature vve knowe nature make v feele goodneſſe howbeit meane whyle foraſmuch ſeeth fitte receiue good reaſon hee ſhould chaunge ſorte tranſfigure ſelf end conforme ſelfe vnto ſeeth fit v cauſe ſayd chastizeth man greef vpon bed vvhen eliu ſpeketh ſo ſhew v god puniſhe v good earneſt nother releaſe truce al meening though ſeeke reſt ſhall finde none god bee enemie ſay take hold wrath scripture ſayth god enemie angrie v meeneth ſo deede pretendeth ſo bycauſe haue neede put feare may ſorie ſinnes let v marke well man ſo tormented hee forced haue warre without end ſeeke haue reſt ſhall find none hand god long ſhall able ſcape till bee reconciled thing ought bee vnderſtoode ſentence god giue v releaſe let v aſſure ourſelues bereth infirmitie ſame ought ſerue ſingular comfort although god examine v roughly bring v euen pit brim yet notwithſtanding hee giueth v ſtill ſome taſte goodneſſe wee may take breathe againe ſayde heere hee hath graunted grace vntoo men perſecuted ſome ſuch ſorte reſt meeneth ſaying ſo ſpeketh reprobate thoſe choſen whoſe ſaluation procured furthered meanes let v vnderſtande god ſuffereth v afflicted ouerſore giueth v ſome litle ſtripes hath reſpect febleneſſe bycauſe ſeeth weake furthermore hee ſayeth man forſaketh meate ſo much findeth tast pleaſaunt meates woulde fayne world ſhewe v touched feeling god wrathe haue conceyued quicke wee find taſt thing vvhat giueth v taſt benefit wee receyued go hand worlde grace true heatheniſhe ſort deſpyſers god whiche ſaped ſinnes become vtterly brutiſhe feele ſting greef doo finde taſte ynough pleaſures yea euen beaſtly pleaſures haue yet conceyued wrathe god thoſe feele god againſt muſt needes miſlike al thing deſirable owne nature yea vtterly lothe why▪ cannot take pleaſure euen liue although life bee full much wretchedneſſe
