sea miſeries yet muſt ſet ſtore bycauſe god hath ſet v preſerueth v intent wee ſhoulde knowe bee creator father according deede end created mainteyned tranſitorie life ſhould know god interteyneth v ſhould feele fatherly goodneſſe pleaſeth haue care v gouerne v life ought deare vnto v reſpect ſheweth himſelf angry life muſt need bitter impoſsible man ſhould deſire bee fordon feeleth according wri • ten ſhall ſay mountaynes couer v thus ye ſee point wee come therfore let v learne find taſt firſt goodneſſe god end reſt benefit may pleaſant vnto v wee may finde ſauor ſay let v learne taſt goodneſſe god ſay let v ſo giuē worldly thing cheef marke ſhould ſay let v ſeeke obey god ſubmit ſelues quietly vnder hand yee ſee muſt deſire haue wee ſo one whenſoeuer inioy benefit giueth v whither eating drincking reſt life let reioycing ſuche wiſe may bee wholly referred acknowledging fatherly goodneſſe god ſay behold god doeth well ſhewe care hath welfare ſeing voutſafeth feede wretched body behold deade carkaſes yet god voutſafeth nouriſhe yee ſee behoueth v eate drinck ſuch ſorte wee may thinke continually vpon goodneſſe god furthermore thing taſt v ſo ouerpreſſed anguiſhe life hatefull v let v conſider whence ſame proceedeth bycauſe god hath hidden cōtenaunce v feele fatherly goodneſſe ſhould make v ſinde taſt ſauoure benefites wee mourne bee perplexitie anguiſhe let v praye god make v feele goodneſſe whiche yet vnknowne v feele let ſerue v take breth ſet v reſt alſo reſtore v ſuch wiſe wheras vtterly diſmayed afore may gather newe courage come againe floure age according ſayde heere byandby thus ye ſee haue beare mynd ſhort ſayd fleſh man ſhall waſte awaye ſo bee ſayde aliue ſo muſt brought nothing god doth vtterly diſfigure v let v loke arme oureſelues pacience enter diſputation although come ſayde extrametie ſayd god hādleth choſen ſort ſpeaking thoſe intendeth ouerthrowe deſtroy thoſe whome hath ordeyned ſaluation hand whome guideth euen thoſe doth hee diſfigure ſuche wiſe man would take vtterly forlorn seing ſo let v pray although become like dead mē yethe wil kepe life hiddē hand needfull ſhould ſo although men afflicted ſo roughly eliu ſpeaketh god vſe ſuch rigour wher liſteth yet notwithſtandding generally behoueth life kind ſhape deathe sainct paule ſayth wee ſee winter time tree haue nother floures leaues freſhneſſe life drawne euen ſo muſt life bee hidden hande god haue done honour put truſt ſhall finde end hath bene good faythfull keeper therefore pleaſe bring v ſuch afterdeale time ſhall perceiue token fauour ſhall ſeeme quite alienated let v tary leyſure mourne til giue v cherefulneſſe ſpoken eliu hath treated affliction whiche god ſendeth faythfull ſhewed muſt firſt bee caſt downe god ſet vp hee addeth god intendeth make feele goodneſſe fauor vſeth word towards heere yee ſee meane whereby god quickneth thoſe bee alienated wit ſendeth ſuch meſſenger hardly foūd amongeſt thouſande ſhall bring meſſage rightuouſneſſe wit bringeth word god iuſtifieth ſinner receiueth accepteth fauor yee ſee ſort reſtored haue bin good dead goodly excellent ſentence ſhewe v god ſendeth v tydings goodneſſe promiſes declared vnto v al one reached v hand drawe v graue vvhat would let v marke well howe ſayde heere man ſhall gather newe ſtrength haue aſſurance god goodneſſe howe ſo haue ſayde alreadie lorde hath giuen propertie goſpell giuing eare promiſes conteyned wee take comforte aſſured hee calleth v truely hard men battels wee haue fyght againſte temptation ourfleſh greateſt battell againſt vnbeleef ſpecially feele god chaſtizementes bee wee darkneſſe ſo much oure ſorowe dimmeth eye although god promiſes ſet afore v yet notwithſtanding apply thē vſe ſeemeth alwayes ſomewhat betwixt v belong v lo plight euery v ought feele owne experience vndoubtedly sathan commeth intermedle himſelfe cace true denie god promiſes wee ſtande mammering ſay heare well promiſe ſo goodly one ought cheere vp whole world linger ſtill vayne bycauſe perceiue ſame ought pertayne vnto mee much therfore ought marke well ſayde namely god ſendeth v man certifieth v goodneſſe one hee reached v hand ſayde vnto v lo hitherto haue afflicted although ſame hath bin great rigoure yet haue done iudge intended puniſh miſdeeds according deſerued phiſition heale true felte firſt fayne vſe ſearing corzying ſearching bone verie violent remedy meane whyle procured health therfore conſider goodneſſe thus yeeſee ſo euer god giueth v holie scripture hande finde promiſe mercie hee ſende v man able warrant v forgiueneſſe ſinnes behoueth v conclude thus ſoeuer word go god pitie mee indeede ſheweth ſending recorde ſpecially benefite goſpell preached vnto v knowe vſe preaching vnbind v vpon earth intent ſhould vnbound heauen chief ende god haue worde miniſtred vnto v much hild priſoners vnder euerlaſting damnation thoſe ordeyned bee miniſters god worde ſhould vnbinde v releaſe oure ſinnes ſaye warrant beare witneſſe vnto v vvee knowe peculiar office god forgiue ſinnes belongeth men lord ieſus chriſte ment expreſſe power workefulneſſe preaching ſaying therethroughe ſinnes forgiuen v yea euen mortall men cauſe saincte paule ſayeth expreſly meſſage whiche committed vnto v meſſage attonement reconciliation chriſtian church goſpel preached purely let v bee ſure god hath committed keeping keyes heauenly kingdome vnto men doe ſo beare abroade word purpoſe end open v gate ſaluation let v aſſure ſelues hee hath giuen authoritie breake oure band according foretold prophete eſay leſus chriſt ſhould bee ſent preache deliueraunce poore priſoners hee hath done owne perſon onely accompliſhing ſayde promiſe hee doeth ſtill alſo dayly miniſters true ieſns chriſte partie hathe let v looce bondage ſinne euerlaſting damnation wherein nature yet hath hee committed ſame charge ſhe peherdes church ye ſee thing whiche wee haue beare mynde eliu ſheweth v meane wherby god reſtored thoſe hee ſent vnto hell good drowned ſendeth meſſanger able warrant rightuouſneſſe ſpeaketh purpoſely ryghtuouſneſſe bycauſe thoſe whiche ought comforte v ſhoulde vſe flattery make v beleeue wee bee ryghtuous preache vnto v oure owne vertues merites rightuouſneſſe ſpeaketh heere god made one v howe bycauſe imputeth oure ſinnes vnto v rightuous ſelues owne vertues bicauſe pleaſeth god forgiue v poynt wee ought marke well world ſeeketh ryghtuouſneſſe bringing men deſerts vnto god imagineth although haue done amiſſe yet able make ſome amendes behold thee common vſe rather abuſe wherewith men deceyue themſelues bee combered heartgreefe feeling vengeance god fall conſidering ſelues howe nowe haue liued well haue ſerued god ought doe though haue committed ſome fault ther ſome meanes recō penny withall yes haue done behold ſay howe men would euer put ſome barre god way end ſhould haue vantage thus ſeeke rightuouſneſſe owne merit god intendeth giue v rightuouſneſſe whereby may ſtande vſeth contrarie kynde ſpeach admitteth v accepteth v ryghtuouſe couering oure ſinnes vvhere ſhall ryghtuouſneſſe reſt free mercie god bycauſe hee hath ſcoured awaye oure ſpots bloud ſonne diſcharged v death damnation raunſome oure lord ieſus chriſt payde vpon croſſe wipeth oute ſinnes layeth oure offence oure charge thus ryghtuouſneſſe preached vntoo v god meſſengers wee iuſtified accepted ryghtuous without cauſe holye ſcripture vſeth continually word iustifie might wel ſayd finde fauour grace god pardoneth v according alſo often ſaid ſo holieghoſte thought ynough vſe ſuch word ſo long wee bee ſinners god muſte needes hate v wee knowe hee welſpring ryghtuouſneſſe agreeument betwene vnryghtuouſneſſe therefore ſo long ſinners lothly god ſight hee muſt needes reiect v bee ſhort haue enteraunce vnto god till wee bee iuſt ryghtuous nowe howe become rightuous bycauſe god regardeth oure ſinnes buryeth hydeth clenſeth v ſinnes wiped death paſsion lord ieſus chriſt ſo much wee bee taken ryghtuous god findeth fault v accepteth v ſort ſonnes ſake ryghtuhuſneſſe ſpoken ſtrayne furthermore whereas ſayde expreſly meſſenger recomforteth v one among thouſande make v ſet ſtore benefyte whereof wee ſildome make account wit meane attonement reconciliation declared ſame baſe common thing time ſtumbled vpon ſhould haue man ſente god warrant ſaluation bee meane oure attonement therefore ſuche thing wee ſhoulde caſt vnder feete cauſe prophete eſay ſayth beutifull feete bring glad tydings peace nowe feete prophet meeneth comming preſence hee ſhoulde ſay worlde knewe benefite god declareth mercie vnto would loue eſteeme thoſe preache goſpell would acknowledge god hath committed ſuche treaſure vntoo ſurmounteth good wiſhe sainct paule alſo alledging ſame text applyeth ſhewe preaching goſpell ſingular gifte god let v thinke ſame commeth men let v fully aſſured reſolued god ſeeketh v goſpell preached vnto v god muſt bee builder thereof ſuch goodneſſe muſt proceed therefore wee father vpon men great vnkyndneſſe vvherefore let v beware wee deface goodneſſe god church ſuch order haue preaching thing let v aſſure ſelues one god came ſeke v bring v ſaluation withall let v knowe hee granteth grace priuiledge al men good ſoth ther country eſteeme alſo worldward eſteemed yet notwithſtanding haue meſſage ſaluation let man go whole world let ſerch al natiōs yea euen thoſe haue bene moſt excellent time paſt let go ſeeke greece al ſciences world incloſed ſeemed let go italie fraunce ſome eſtimation let go spaine ſhall hee finde vtter deſolation onely thoſe ought meſſengers ſaluation vtterly dumme whiche worſe yee ſhall heare maſtie dogges barking oute blaſphemies againſte god yee ſhall ſee wretched ſoules led deſtruction diuell hunting euerie praye vndoubtedly looke howe manye preacher goe vp pulpit ſo many dogges hunt fetche game bring sathans toyles wretched ſoules maye goe damnation heere wee haue god promiſes preached vnto v leade v ſaluation therefore wee ſee without cauſe ſayde faythfull meſſenger god grace odde man among thouſande ſo rare benefite wee ought eſteeme hyghly howe ſayde make v eſteeme perſons make v receyue benefite miniſtered vntoo v greater reuerence ſay make v receyue grace god ſo much pleaſeth drawe v iuſtifie v fatherly loue ſhewing v although wee bee wretched miſerable bee nothing v deathe damnation yet hee leaue v deliuer v meane oure lorde ieſus chriſte nowe let v fall downe face oure good god praying ſo make v feele faultes wee may mortifie luſtes bee withdrawn corruption world frame ſelues ſeeke vnto much mortal life ſubiect much wretch edneſſe miſerie may pleaſe reach v hand aboue deliuer v hee hath taken v gulfe death may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nacions earth c cxxvj sermon fifth vpon xxxiij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon xxiij xxiiij xxv verſes vpon added heere 29 ſhal pray god appeaſe behold face triumphe man rightuouſneſſe ſhall reſtored vnto ſaw yeſterday whē god afflicteth v procureth oure ſaluation mean although ſeeme ſo v true wicked ſhalbe afflicted doth make thē hardhearted chafe againſt god ſo little fare better afflictiō doth bewraye thire wickednes bring full meaſure whē god afflicteth choſen ouermaſtreth mortifieth thē ſuch wiſe tremble maieſtie becom vtterly diſmayed like mē half dead inſomuch hope life thē reſpect themſelues worldward finally ther remaineth nothing god ſhuld haue pitie eliu ſetteth meane whereby god maketh chaſtizemēts auaileable towards faithful wit comforting goodneſſe telling readie forgiue ſins althoughe affliction bee oure profite ſerue v medicine ſalues ſhewed yeſterdaye yet notwithſtanding appeereth ſo ende nowe ende ſhewed v heere whiche god reacheth v hande aſſuring v hee bee mercifull v howe ſo euer worlde goe notwithſtanding hee hath handled v roughly let v marke well life oure ſoules conſiſteth worde god whereby hee gyueth v aſſurance mercie goodneſſe towardes v intente wee ſhoulde eſteeme benefite deſerueth ſayde hee warranter remiſsion oure ſinnes odde man among thouſande ſo hee found aduenture treaſure god reſerueth thoſe whome hee thinketh good beſides haue tolde god promiſing men forgiueneſſe ſinnes giueth charge commiſsion miniſters word drawe death according expreſſely ſayd keyes kingdome heauen committed thoſe preach goſpell ende forgiue ſinnes owne authoritie intent wretched ſinners may better aſſured ſaluation doubt god receyueth mercie therefore miniſters tell name bee quit iudgement ſeate cauſe expreſſely ſayde god haue mercie man hee ſendeth good faythfull teacher giueth appoynted miniſters ſayde charge office reſcuing deliuering wretched creature way damnation howe ende theſe thinges may bee better vnderſtoode heere three point marked one eliu ſheweth v cauſe foundation forgiueneſſe oure ſinnes namely god mercifull vnto v infinite goodnes wil haue v periſh one point ſeconde office ſuch preach goſpell drawe wretched ſoules death ſet libertie third ſame done expreſſe commiſsion giuen god according alſo belongeth mortall man take vpon ſo hygh thing aboue abilitie touching firſt point ſee holy ghoſt bringeth v welſpring grace wee obteyne god vvhen forgiueth v ourſinnes worthy able bee beforehande bring thing ought procure fauour towards v bycauſe loketh vpon v mercy ſhort holy ghoſt fathereth remiſsion ſinnes vpō free goodneſſe god wee ſo wretched nothing damnation v behold pleaſeth god ſuccour v doth thing hee findeth v ſaue infinite miſeries owne goodneſſe moueth thervnto point ought marke well end come obteyne forgyueneſſe god hand may imagin appeaze owne merit particauſers remiſsion ſinnes looke vpon told v wit god haue pitie v receiueth v mercie hand ſo eliu ment aduertize v god doth alwayes make v feele goodneſſe although loue v bee minded prouide thing knoweth profitable v yet doth hee alwayes giue v feeling hideth vtterly v god afflicteth v ſayde turneth backe v elſe hee voutſafeth looke vpon v elſe countenaunce louring towardes v able beholde let v marke well faythfull ſhal diſmayed ſeke god able find hath forgotten reiected bicauſe hee make feele loue cauſe eliu ſayeth expreſſely god mercifull v hee ſendeth v witneſſe forgiueneſſe ſinnes word hee ſo bycauſe wee ſure experience take poſſeſsion goodneſſe vnknown vnto v time ſeconde poynt office ſuch preache goſpel forgiue ſinnes notable poynt without vtterly forlorne paſt recouerie ther none meane giue v hope ſaluation aſſuring v oure ſinnes forgiuen afore god wee quite cleane diſcharged hath bene ſayd ryghtuouſneſſe whereby acceptable vnto long oure ſinnes imputed vnto v god muſt needes hate v elſe beeing god wrath vpon v bottomleſſe gulfe curſedneſſe againe wee reconciled vntoo gate paradiſe opened vnto v acknowledgeth v child heritage heauen alreadie prepared v howe may obteyned hauing good faythfull teacher preache goſpel vnto v end whereat god ameth attonement reconciliation v according sainct paule declareth hee expreſſeth propertie goſpel meſſage attonement betweene god man ieſus chriſt knewe ſinne vnſpotted lambe put himſelfe vnder curſe ſinnes end ſhould finde rightuouſneſſe god ſaye wee waſhed bloud haue put oure ſelues vnder ſacrifice hee hath offered wee bee taken reputed rightuous bycauſe ſayde ſacrifice power put away fault offence lo behoueth v marke place therefore ſo euer reade holie ſcripture come ſermon promis god goodneſſe ſet afore v let v aſſure ſelues god warranteth loue towards v end ſhould deliuered death wherein plunged although wee heare mortal man voice ſound diſperſeth vaniſheth ayre yet muſt beleue god worke ſuch wiſe power ſayde doctrine ſhall bee ſufficient deliuer v damnation wherin bondage ſinne ſo ſhall paſſe bond satan bee ſet cleere god ſaying namely ſo euer loſe earth ſhal loſed alſo heauen cannot faile v ſo wee ſee importaunce worde ſayde deliuer ſinner ſet ſinner free god giueth expreſſe charge ſuch ſpeake vnto v drawe v gulfe death wee myght enter intoo paradiſe one voyce ſounded heauen verie deed saint iames ſpeaking priuate perſons ſayth warneth brother ſhal ſaue ſoule loſt take place al thoſe bring men good waye ſhall doe ſeeing wee haue ſpeciall zeale oure lorde ieſus chriſt hath giuen word ſuche time ſame preached v ſheepeherds church wit office releaſe forgiue ſinnes haue alledged already saincte iohn bynde vnbynde haue alledged sainct mathew ſhort ſee power goſpel receyue promiſes faith namely much god ſhuld reache v hande heauen pull v dungeon death herewithall let v marke third point done god ordinance ſerueth difference betweene goſpell blaſphemies pope pope vpholdeth chaplens haue keyes kingdom heauen office forgiuing commiſsion ſhewe tye forgiueneſſe ſinnes ſhrifte god euer tell men behoueth men ſhriue ſecretes eare mortall man obteyne mercie god declareth ſinner ſighe ſinnes hee mercifull beholde mortall creature preſumeth make lawe ſhet men paradyſe obſerue notoriouſe vſurping god power beſides pope hathe bulle • indulgence pardon ſuche thing ground forgiueneſſe ſinnes vpon therewithall mingleth bloude martyr hee meeneth expreſſely deface vertue deathe paſsion oure lorde ieſus chriſte yet notwithſtanding meane whyle hee hath promis goſpell hee hath nothing toyes ceremony ſorceries great croſſes vpon backe ſuche traſhe whiche concluſion nothing satan gewgawes contrariwiſe ſayde forgiueneſſe ſinnes withoute god meſſage ſaye without preaching doctrine vvhen pope forgiueth ſinnes dumme hee bringeth one iote god worde nother hath hee thing charmes ſorceries ſayde afore moreouer hee layeth tyrannous lawes vpon men neckes ouerthrowe meane lord hath ordeined againe abridgeth god himſelfe libertie let diſappoint god ſhould receyue ſinners mercie ye ſee popiſhe churche diuels ſynagoge deſtitute forgiueneſſe ſinnes conſequently damned ſo long holdeth ſelfe tradicions antechriſt impoſsible ſhoulde reconciled vnto god contrarie parte wee ſaye mennes ſinnes forgiuen receyuing meſſage goſpell ſame hath ceremony men haue deuiſed lawes whiche haue inuented owne pleaſure onely wee muſt followe order rule oure lorde ieſus hath ſtabliſhed hath remiſsion ſinnes hande hath giuen v meane whereby haue done preaching goſpell receyuing aſſured fayth therfore ſticke ſimplicitie may ſure commiſsion commeth aboue men take ne vſurpe thing vppon owne brayne thus ye ſee haue marke vpon word ſayd god pitie deliuer muſt euery whit come aboue none god muſt woorke behalfe free goodneſſe according alſo himſelf proteſteth prophet eſay ſaying hee ſelfe hee whiche wipeth thine iniquity iſraell muſt ſuch benefite needes procede creature giue vnto v wee ſee ſubſtāce text ſo wel vnderſtood immediatly ſayd ende ſoule ſhould enter pit vvee haue ſeene already heretofore wretched ſinners neere graue good deade conſumed ſo long god purſueth rigor eliu addeth god preuenteth miſcheef ſending ſaid meſſage releaſe ſinnes ſo wee fall graue ſaye wee periſhe cace ſtandeth vppon temporall death vpon damnation wherin wee ſhould vtterly ouerwhelmed god preuent preſerue v infinite goodneſſe thē let v marke whyle wee afflicted wee bee couered darkneſſe death ſeemeth v getting yet notwithſtanding euen time god ſuſteyneth v couert although wee perceyue reſt vppon yet notwithſtanding hee ſheweth v fauour without knowledge behoueth god worke behalfe although wee cannot conceyue vndoubtedly wee begin take hold goodneſſe fayth muſt lay firſt point ſaluation wee muſt mount vp hygher namely choze v wee borne thence forth hee continueth goodneſſe alwayes towards v let v marke god owne goodneſſe choze v ſecret maner incomprehenſible naturall vnderſtanding agayne pleaſeth manifeſt goodneſſe vnto v thing hee doeth goſpell preached vnto v hee ſheweth v hee willing haue v deliuered graue therfore wee perceiue deliuerance ſaluation taſt promiſes goſpell done throughly firſt god giueth v ſome ſmall taſte confirming ſame v vntill wee ſee gate paradiſe wyde open deliuered frō graue lo haue marke vppon ſaying furthermore eliu ſayeth god hath found reconciliation let v marke hee intendeth expreſſe yet better thing touched euen vvhich muſt father attonement god maketh v vpon god owne free goodneſſe hee whiche worketh yea euen wee could haue thought mynd come vnto muſt fayne ſeeke v gone aſtray haue forgotten according ſaying prophet eſay true often commaunded ſeke god turne vnto haue offended cannot done except teach v inwardly touche v ſo quicke may inforced miſlyke ſinnes againe hee giueth v hope cauſeth v runne vnto god refuge himſelfe inlyghtening v fayth without cauſe eliu addeth god found reconciliation hee afflicteth v hee prepareth v aforehand receyue grace hee intendeth giue v ſo long bee puffed vp pryde god goodneſſe hath entrance v long hardned ſinnes beate back ſayd grace greate way v ſo long ſaped filthineſſe ſurely cannot taſt reconciliation whiche made lord ieſus chriſt therfore god muſt fayne worke work muſt bee altogither worketh hee firſt bringing v knowledge ſinnes hartbyting hee giueth v according hath bin ſayd hertofore ſendeth v inward feare ſoūded trumpet ſummon v iudgement ye ſee thē god calleth v home ſecret inſpirations ſeeth v gone aſtray diſtraught beſides appointeth men warne v reproue v ſurely another greate benefite haue good faythfull teacher ſhewe v ſinnes quicke threten v euerlaſting damnation furthermore ſuffize wee ſee wee dull vppon ſpur god neede kick prick v roughly hee addeth correctious hand afflicteth v ye ſee wee muſt profit ourſelues correction end like ſtithies beat back ſtrokes neuertheleſſe god working bring paſſe giueth v hart fleſh ſoftneth hardneſſe curſed • ature vvell hath god made correction take place hyghe tyme manifeſt mercye vntoo v make v taſt ſee well th 〈…〉 findeth reconciliation 〈…〉 nothing aforehand rather wee ſtill drawe backe vvhen god teacheth v plyght ••• wee let v alone wee drunken luſtes without thinking vpon although ſend v good warning conuicted euill yet notwithſtanding wee labour ſtill burie intent ſhoulde bee ſeene ſome grind teethe chafe god ſheweth ſinnes ſo little abyde doo nothing elſe byte kick otherſome become vtterly ſenſeleſſe ſuch dulneſſe followeth amendment euer man ſay therfore behoueth god worke behalf againe hee ſhall haue afflicted v vttermoſte yet ſhall ryght odedientneſſe v yea wee bee euen confounded wee ſhall ſtill like wretched mad men according wee ſee happened cayn iudas lo plyght wee ſhoulde bee god wrought v therfore wee haue meſſage ſaluation ſhall become v although wee throughly tamed nothing elſe ſighe grone yet notwithſtanding would turne deſpaire v thē behoueth v acceptable tyme come vnto v according ſaid another place eſay behold acceptable tyme behold dayes ſaluation doeth terme tyme ſaluation acceptable time bycauſe god hath chozē owne mere goodneſſe cauſe alſo ſayd another place eſay comfort yee comfort yee people ſhall lord ſay thus comfort v affliction elſe wee ſhould bee ſwallowed vp ſorowe therfore hee addeth hee repenteth hart hee ſcourged people telleth tyme comfort come herein wee ſee certayne declaration thing touched breefly god peculiar office find recōciliation neuertheleſſe god miniſters ſo oft promiſes goſpell offered vnto v wherin god calleth v ſheweth himſelfe fauorable lord ieſus chriſts ſake giuing v grace taſt goodneſſe aſſuring v ready receyue v mercye let v aſſure ourſelues conuenient tyme whiche hee hath appointed ſaluation let v humble ourſelues bee ſure wee haue preuented hath ſought v therewithall let v behind hand vppon ſuche occaſion according ſainct paule edging ſaid text eſay haue touched ſheweth v wee muſt bee ready come lord calleth v muſt driue day day reconciliation found offered vnto v herevpon eliu concludeth man ſo comforted meſſage god ſendeth becommeth yong agayne reſtored fleſhe becommeth freſh yong chyldes vvherin hee ſheweth true meane cōforting v vvhich forget god ſeeke fond vanity ſotte ſelues withall certified god goodneſſe article wee ought marke well vvee ſee ſort men labour comfort themſelues namely forgetting god ſeemeth melancolike matter thinke vpon good ſooth many ſaye ſtoutly ynough bee chriſtians yet notwithſtanding intend mery dryue away thought god eternall life ſo alſo offend god ſet purpoſe cannot mery euill seing nature men ſuch atteynted diſeaſe let v looke well ſelues ſure mirth ſhall bliſſed aboue except aſſured remiſsion ſinnes therfore wee haue god fauour ſo wee call vpō eliu byandby adde therin conſiſteth true gladneſſe alowed god laſting bring v ſaluatiō ſo long v know cace wee good god ne ſeeke reconcyled vnto lie routing ſtil filthineſſe wee deſire mery wee kindle god vengeance againſt v increaſe ſtill fire wrath wee plundge ſelues deeper bottomleſſe pitte yee ſee needfull ſhuld ſhewed v much ſtādeth v hand well aſſured god mercifulneſſe towards v alſo cauſe holy ſcripture treateth giuing ioy comfort vnto v doeth alwayes ſet v fauour god ſaying behold god mercifull therfore bee glad beholde redemer ſeketh ioyne knit god father therfore ye glad ye quiet bee yee reſt conſciences hereby wee admoniſhed muſt need trouble vnquietneſſe ſo long knowe cace bee god true wicked ſeeke meanes ynough make ſelues mery good fayth ruffle ſee deſpizing god howſoeuer world go yet doeth god ſend ſuch pricking torment mynd bee ſore diſtreſſed daunce faſhion ſpoken moyſes namely yet neuertheleſſe ſin dore wayteth like dog wayteth maiſter ye ſee wicked may ruffle yet go dores without gnawing conſcience god muſt ſtill hold bay therfore ſomuch ought wee thinke vpon doctrine wit wee turne backe vnto god ne bury ſinnes whē would haue peace wee alwayes haue ſome promis god comfort v wee ſee god allureth v ſaluation let v glad thē ſhall gladneſſe bee bleſſed wee haue taſte god father ſanctifie ioyes without muſt needes quayle way v reioyce marke one point ſecond wee haue alſo marke grace god ought ſuffize v though wee haue neuer ſo many ſorowes mingled according god excerciſe v hee wil ſend v full ioye ſo myght laugh open mouth ſay yet notwithſtanding behoueth v bee contented certeyntie wee haue father ſhall find mercy haue priuiledge abilitie call vpon god aſſure ſelues gate open v ſhall haue good acceſſe vnto name lord ieſus chriſt ſay haue boldneſſe thorough owne raſhneſſe hath voutſafed open holy mouth witneſſe loue vnto v whiche thing hee doeth goſpell publiſhed let v aſſure ſelues muſt reſt wholy thervpon though haue neuer ſo many ſorowes incomberances yea behoueth v paſſe ſurmount reioyce miſeries tribulation ſeing god loue printed hart holy ſpirit wit ſeing god voutſafeth bee father ſauiour hath ſhewed ſame word alſo dede perſon sonne hath ſpared giuen death v thus yee ſee haue marke ſayd man ſhall gather new ſtrength reſtored againe fleſh ſhal become freſh yong childes ſerueth ſhewe although wee feele many miſeries world certayne muſt haue many aduerſities paſsing tranſitory life yet notwithſtanding ſhall ceaſe haue ioye ſhall ouercome get victory thing lord comfort v goodneſſe sainct paule meeneth hee ſayeth peace paſſeth man vnderſtanding ſhall get vpper hand hart vvhen ſpeaketh peace god meeneth gladneſſe giuē v remiſsiō ſinnes ſayeth ſame peace paſſeth al man vnderſtanding afterward addeth ſame getteth vpper hand victory hart meening whyle liue world ſhall haue many trouble greefes yea daunger death euery blowe yet notwithſtanding ſayd peace god getteth vpper hād maketh v conquerers fighting vndoubtedly ſyth wee ſee lord inlighteneth v ought ſuffize v according ſaid fourth pſalme welth world cannot make ſo glad fleſhly deſire theſe wordly thing making ſporte mirth fare well ſo haue good ſtore eate drinke true ſhall ſee mery howbeeit god make countenaunce ſhyne vpon v ioye muſt need ſurmount thing worldling woont deſire whē eliu hath ſpoken ſo hee addeth immediatly man ſhall pray vntoo god appeaſe finde fauorable beholde yet one point whiche importeth much without calling vpon name god know rightly frute ioye ſpoken wherin conſiſteth welfare euen wee may boldly come vnto god haue leaue reſt lappe wee afflicted ſo wee knowe mercifull v hath promiſed ſay ſouereine welfare men ſo long liue world vndoubtedly prayer thing whereby come vnto god behoueth v walke faith god abſent v reſpecte eyeſight although dwel v power make v fele grace yet notwithſtanding ſeparated outward appeareance neuertheleſſe prayer wee mount vp heauen preſent ourſelues maieſtie ſhort ioyned vnto yee ſee band familiarity betweene god men libertie hee giueth v call vpon yet pray vnto ought except knowe goodneſſe according ſayd fifth pſalme lord woſhip temple euen vpon multitude mercy vntill ſuch time god hath certified v father poſsible v dare come vnto mouth ſhet hart locked vp ſhort wee vtterly excluded priuiledge calling vpō cauſe ſayd holy ghoſt ſealeth adoption ende wee may crye abba father wherby wee ſure heare v place ſainct paule ſayeth ieſus chriſt wee haue beleefe god beleefe ingendreth truſt ende wee may come boldly throne god pray vnto yee ſee ſhewed v man ſo comforted promiſes goſpell byandby calleth vpon god findeth fauour hand ſo let v marke firſt prayer whiche men make without taſt god goodneſſe diſsimulation yea ſtarke abhomination true wee cannot ſo ſure requiſite although pray vnto god yet haue wee perfect fayth yet wee haue full purpoſe v go vnto god father bicauſe calleth v grounded vpon promiſes diſhonour name praying prayer ſhal turned vnto ſinne hereby man may ſee curſed wretched ſtate papiſts wee ought well thinke vpon end may bee ſory deſtruction magnifie god goodneſſe ſomuch hath pleaſed drawe v ſuch dungeon papiſts thinke pray god deuoutly ynough yea meane whyle hold principle man muſt alwayes doubt god fauour yea haue ta ſtat god promiſes go aduenture cauſe make ſo many windlaſſes ſeeke ſo many patrones aduocates deuiſe ſo many meanes goe vnto god honour ſubmit themſelues word truſt fully yee ſee papiſtes alwayes doubte yea needes doubte meanes wherof ſo farre priuiledge calling vpon god herd hand rather continually beaten backe ſainct iames ſayeth man come doubting require thing god hee muſt neuer thinke obteine ought prayer muſt grounded vpon god word therfore wee ſee without cauſe 〈…〉 liu ſayeth man ſo comforted pray vnto god let v marke wee 〈…〉 diſpoſed pray vntill wee knowe god calleth v one generall reaſon behoueth v hold▪ according ſayd prophet ſay people ſhall aunſwere mee 〈…〉 god god muſt begin thunder vnto v wee bee ſure ſaluation ſhall bee good melody except god haue firſt thundered v ſay except haue giuen v boldneſſe promis anſwere vntoo god therfore oft pray let v begin promiſes conteyned holy ſcripture conſider god calleth v promiſeth heare v wee may boldly go vntoo yea yet let v ceaſſe meane whyle walke feare let v conſider wee come preſent ſelues maieſtie god let ſay leade v humilitie reuerence according ſayd text whiche haue alledged fifte pſalme namely lord enter temple worſhip feare let v conſider maieſtie god wee may bee afrayde ſtoupe ſubmit ourſelues lowlineſſe yet notwithſtanding let v ceaſe take courage continually become bold bycauſe hath pleaſed good god call v vntoo promiſe v comming ſhall vayne yee ſee wee haue marke although wee haue conceiued aſſuredneſſe god good fully beleeue receyue v yet notwithſtanding muſt ceaſſe humble ſelues lowlineſſe knowing wee ſhall alwayes find pitifull mercifull father towards v ſeking wee hold ryght way ſheweth v let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying ſo put away wee may doubte accept v ryghteouſe lord ieſus chriſtes ſake graunte v grace comming preſent ourſelues vnto may bee diſcharged burthen ſinnes alſo bee ſo clenſed hee may dwell v ſo gouerne v holy ſpirit may walke obedience lawe holy commaundements hee hath giuen v ſo let v ſay almighty god heauenly father acknowledge cōfeſſe according truthe wee woorthye lyfte vp eye heauen preſent ſelues thee preſume ſo farre prayer ſhould c the▪ cxxvij sermon ſixth vpon the▪ xxxiij chapter 26 ſhall pray vnto god fauorable ſhall ſee face ioy render returne man righteouſneſſe 27 looke towards men ſay haue ſinned haue turned away goodneſſe hath profited mee 29 hath redemed ſoule ende ſhould go downe graue life ende ſhould ſee light according whiche declared yeſterdaye eliu ſheweth v men reconcilied vnto god maye call vppon quiet ſtedfaſt cōſcience true frute faith haue ſuch quietneſſe may ſure god loueth v flee refuge without wee curſed cace vndoubtedly although al good world wee ſhould bee ſure inioy one minute houre except god maynteyned v poſſeſsion moreouer let v put cace man myght cō tinue eaſe pleaſure tyme life yet ſhould god benefites turne deſtruction damnation vnleſſe hee vſed purely ſure ſayd fatherly loue god vvee ſee wee cannot call vppon god ſuch certeinty hee heare v accept prayer pitie life somuch behoueth v marke well order ſhewed holy ghoſt god ſhal haue certified v goodneſſe towards v wee knowing therein hee bee fauorable v pardon ſinnes may ſeeke vnto boldy preſent ſelues cauſe added text god ſhew face righteouſneſſe ſhall returne vnto meane elſe man ſhall ſee face god wee muſt greately ſtand vppon word ſeing meening euident therfore one ſayd ſo long men accuſed owne conſcience cannot think vpon god terrour ſo could find hart neuer perceiue thing man ſhould ſpeake might haue inckling doubt wee ſee ſo long ſinners aſleepe euill deſire nothing ſo much forget god mention bee made intollerable torment offender brought iudge yee ſee long wretched creature buried ſinnes cannot thinke vppon god greate greef haue aſſurance forgiueneſſe ſinnes come boldly god glad thinke vpon wee willing heare yea reioyceth v behold face sainct paule meeneth ſaying wee finde peace godward wee bee iuſtified fayth alſo ſaying hee meeneth wicked haue reſt bee fallen aſleepe rather dulled ſuch wiſe thinke vppon god thus yee ſee heathniſhe ſort ſuch ſeke feede ſelues vice labour forget god ſettle themſelues thervpon god bringeth remembraunce wake yea euen ſorowe cōtrariwiſe certified god receiueth v mercy wherof fayth good ſure warrant good boldly vnto haue peace neerer come maieſtie truſt haue wee ſaluation foraſmuch hee deſireth nothing bee father according hee hath ſhewed deede matter treated yeſterday confirmed yet againe ſayd righteouſneſſe ſhall reſtored vnto man eliu ſayd heretofore wretched creature bee trouble ſo hee feele god wrathe vengeance way comfort ſpecially reſtore life except goſpell preached god ſend ſome man tel word purely wherby wretched ſinner ouerwhelmee may knowe gate paradiſe opened vnto diſcourſing herevpon eliu ſayd preacher goſpel ſhould declare ſo afflicted righteouſneſſe righteouſneſſe haue declared already men righteouſe themſelues able ſtand god righteouſneſſe god burieth fault imputeth vnto clenſeth owne free goodneſſe blood ieſus chriſt ſpirituall waſhing ſoules namely watered holy ghoſt ſainct peter ſayeth yee ſee alſo vnderſtanding text man righteouſneſſe ſhal reſtored vnto returne againe ſo long god purſueth v iudge ſummoneth v yeeld vp account ouerwhelmed ſinnes needeth proceſſe witneſſe agaynſt v whē god calleth v himſelf ſheweth v good remedie v bee diſcharged bond death wherin bound remedy put whole truſt death paſsion lord ieſus chriſt receiue imbrace promiſes ſaluation hee giueth v returning righteouſneſſe vnto v bin erſt alienated v wherof wee bin vtterly bereft let v learne nurriſh ſinnes booſome wee ſhall gayne nothing laying playſters vpon ſores hyde rottenneſſe increace wee muſt needes drop aſunder ende altogither infected v flatter ourſelues ſeke vayne ſtartingholes muſt come right foorth vnto god ſuffer ſelues bee reproued wee feele remorſe conſcience let v receiue humbly ſory miſdoings wee haue profited litle warning god hath ſent v leaſtwiſe let v paſt amendment chaſtizeth v beaten roddes let v ſo caſt downe ourſelues may ſeke nothing mere mercy conſidering vtterly vndone helpe v ye ſee thē behoueth v deale meanes let v doubt righteouſneſſe ſhall bee reſtored vnto v according ſayd prophet eſay wee bee imbrued blood ſinnes inſomuch ſtayne ſoked v god make v whyte ſnowe wee returne vnto pure hart let v thinke herevppon god pardoneth ſinnes let v fall aſleepe ende wee ſhould ſeeke make priuiledge giuen v auaylable wit bee bold call vpon father aſſure ſelues heare v eliu hauing ſpoken ſo addeth wil loke towards men ſay haue ſinned haue turned awaye goodneſſe hath booted hee hath deliuered ſoule pit text expounded ſome men though eliu ſpake god ſaying hee looketh ſo towards men man ſay haue done amiſſe wheras hee beene darkneſſe death god deliuereth ſoule pit reſtoreth light life howbeeit foraſmuch word word ſet downe thus looke towards men ſay haue done amiſſe haue turned away goodneſſe hath ſtoode ſtead meete conuenient mee man maye ſee eaſly gather eliu goeth ſtill matter ſhewing brought ſo lowe feele ſinnes bee euen deathes dore god ſhew fauour call back againe giue hope life ſpecially cheere hart ſo able cal vpō true aſſuredneſſe faithe doo afterward turne themſelues men declare miſeries intent magnifie infinite goodneſſe god haue felt ſo ſecond frute forgiueneſſe ſinnes wretched ſinner knoweth god hath ſhaken yet openeth way giueth acceſſe come vntoo like hee reſted thervpon call vpon god afterward made frute faith auaylable ſo alſo behoueth confeſſe ſayd goodneſſe god men aſhamed ſhewe miſery wherin hee vntill god deliuered mercy ſhort like god hath ſent v promiſes goſpell wee ought acknowledge thē ſeeke vnto ſo alſo behoueth v mourne mē ynough euery v ſhould pray god priuily himſelfe behoueth v alſo ſet forth glory indeuer prouoke neighbour ſame ſo one v may edified another hee hath felt good mercyfull god muſt ſhewe vntoo others may take example ſuch agrement amongs v muſt alſo preache god praiſes togither according euery one v bound vntoo man may iuſtly confeſſe god hath hundred time plucked graue quickned ye ſee thē effect meening eliu howbeit may better profit ſentence let v marke behoueth v firſt enter ourſelues thē go vnto god afterward go vnto neighbour thus ye ſee three thing wee haue marke order wee ought kepe well firſt men ſhould examin owne conſciēces haue eye whole lyfe aſhamed ſinnes vntill wee haue well perceyued wee bee worſe wretched haue recourſe vnto god vvee moued ſeke deſire forgiueneſſe requiſite v begin ſayd point namely feele ſinnes greuouſe bee alſo feele conceyue wrathe god intent wee may bee forlorne behold hell gaping vpon v ſwallowe v vp ſo vtterly aſtoniſhed may driuen ſay ala done may haue reſt ourſelues languiſhe ſo miſeries wee may come earneſt zeale ſeke lord thus ye ſee firſt ſteppe wee muſt begin ſecond wee muſt come vnto god ſeeing hee taryeth till wee ſeeke infinite goodneſſe preuenteth v ſomuch hee inſpireth v end ſhould ſeeke flee refuge vnto mercie reſt whē haue promiſes goodneſſe ſet afore v ſeing hee ſeketh ſinners bring death life wee muſt take thoſe promiſes apply vſe ſaying euen ſo god thou ſheweſt thou art willing receiue ſinners mercy behold one yea ſo forlorne wote doo therfore doubt lord thou wilt make mee feele grace goodneſſe lord reſt although bee hemmed many trouble ſorowes able turne thee yet reſt vpon thy promiſes therwith call vpon thee aſſuring myſelfe thou wilt ſtrengthen mee againſt satan temptation thus ye ſee behoueth v deale third point concluſion eliu maketh muſt declare god goodneſſe neighbour ſo farforth needfull edifying may praiſed one accord men may confeſſe welfare mercy damned goodneſſe god remedy theſe ſay three degree behoueth v keepe told muſt begin ourſelues vvee ſhall ſee many blaſe abroade god praiſes full mouth haue well foremynded thē hart think themſelues diſcharged haue ſayd god haue pitie vpon mee haue bene ſuch one haue done ſuch euill deede true ſuch men haue ſome feeling themſelues ſpeake altogither hypocriſie yet notwithſtanding much wind mouth larger heart ſcarcely haue taſted god mercy yet would haue men thinke haue felt throughly full fraught vanitie ambition ſuch men wyden mouth ſort ſpeake well meane whyle haue mynded god grace feele accordingly myght well imprinted conſciences themſelues bee ryghtly nurriſhed cauſe ſayd wee ſpeake behoueth v haue conſidered well haue ſeene afore ſay haue examined well ſelues haue bene diligent ſerching wretched wee haue bene come verie point haue bene ſwallowed vp dungeon hell afterward wee haue bene brought afterdeele imbrace god promiſes haue ſuch lyuely feeling wee maye call vppon full truſt true cannot bee doone perfectly yet muſt wee go towards yet muſt wee creepe neerer neerer wee muſt ſtrayne ourſelues come verie well haue wee made ſuch profers tyme open mouth prayſe god goodneſſe men may bee drawne example men may know none hope ſaluation infinite goodneſſe pleaſeth make death paſsion sonne auaylable take away ſinnes ſo wee may waſſhed cleane ſpottes vncleanneſſe accepted ryghteouſe matter concerneth ſhrift papiſtes confeſsion chriſtian ought put vre among v haue told heretofore one curſed blaſphemies popedome tye forgiueneſſe ſinnes shrift made mannes eare god neuer requyred good ſooth vnpoſsible euer men ſhould knowe hundreth part fault meene euen groſſeſt fault ſhall doo go number offence haue doone vnwittingly therfore shrift amōg papiſts gulf hell chriſtian confeſsion allowed woord god wee ſhould generally confeſſe ſinnes v hathe giuen cauſe ſtumbling hee ſhould acknowledge fault amend euill ſay thing wee haue god ſhall haue afflicted v afterward remedied aduerſities ment wee ſhould go blowe mannes eare tell offence alſo wee ſhould mount vp vpon ſcaffold tell particularly fault wee haue committed maner wee wee neede confeſſe defaultes generall therewithall conſider lord hath bound v exceedingly hee hath giuen v happie wiſſhed end toubles would haue ouerwhelmed v hee reached v hand ſet v vp againe alſo wee haue offended neyghbours giuing euill example wee muſt acknowledge fault bee aſhamed confeſſe ſorineſſe hart ſayd latter confeſſion ill practized among v wee ſee pryde moſt men true dare ſay bee righteouſe howbeeit confeſſe themſelues ſinners cloke hypocriſie ſay men ſo ſo wheras euery man ought feele owne miſdooings wee fall couering mantle men playne mocking god wee intend confeſſe vnfeynedly wee bound vnto god humble ourſelues let v ſpeake according feeling owne conſciences miſerie wherin wee haue bene plūdged deadlineſſe wherout god hath made v way marke one point alſo otherſome haue committed offence doo fall blaſpheming god whole ſtreete infected whoredome man reproue aske whither bring backe popiſhneſſe bycauſe bee told fault would ſay god would haue ſtumbling block nurriſhed partie hathe troubled church ſhould fare better hardneſſe wilfull ſtubbornneſſe let v marke god diſcouereth ſinnes ende wee haue cauſed trouble offence wee ſhould labour amend aſhamed open mouth confeſſe wee haue doone thing ſhewed v namely ſinner wil ſeeke vnto god pardon afterward come familiarly take father truſting mercy hee muſt alſo turne himſelfe vnto men hee muſt pray ſecret ſay hart haue ſinned ſort aske forgiueneſſe returne vnto god hee muſt alſo turne vnto neighbour wheras erſt hee went aboute deceiue god would haue rocked owne conſcience aſleepe ſhall cōceiue ſuch greef confuzion himſelf god ſhall glorified ſuch aſleepe ſhall awake thoſe whoſe mouthes taſt ſhall find ſome • auour grace god ſuch ſwalowed vp ſorowe ſhall knowe god opened gate come vnto bee ſhort ſuch deſpayre ſhall recouer hope life ſaluation ye ſee holy ghoſt ment effect declare text haue prayed vnto god euery man ſecretly himſelf wee muſt likewiſe offer generall ſacrifice men▪ acknowledging much boūd goodneſſe humbling ſelues ſinnes conſidering wee bin damned creature pitied v therfore ſayd hee haue eye vnto mē behooueth v mark order wherof haue made mention already eliu began point ſayde entraunce ſinner ſhall wakened namely god ſhal ſend remorſe conſcience hee receyue become better warning giuen bee afrayd god iuſtice threatnings made vnto hee ſhall feele hand ſo hard heuie hee ſhall inforced perceyue owne confuzion greeued become dead mā afterward hee ſhall come quickening god ſhall cauſe goſpell preached promiſes ſaluation bee offered vnto hee ſhall receyue benefit herevpon ſhall call vnto god conceiue ſuch confidence ſhall without douting go vnto god vnto father ſay seing god hath adopted number child may well take libertie cōming vnto ſeing allureth mee ſo ſweetly vntoo muſt doubt receyue mee doone tyme looke towards men wee ſhould looke firſt vntoo men make fayre confeſsions wee haue beene ſorie throughly greeued within peruerting order nature wee haue felt well greeuouſneſſe god iudgements afterward able receyue promiſes goſpell call vpon god truſt reſt vpon mercie fatherly goodneſſe feeling fauorable v redie help v wee haue doone tyme looke towards men ſay edifie neyghbours inferior thing hath bin declared afore done looking towards men wee muſt ſay haue ſinned haue turned aſide goodneſſe haue bene wretched man ſhewed v ſort god ought glorified v wit muſt acknowledge righteouſe nothing iniquitie v paule ſayeth third romaynes whē ſayth god iuſtified meeneth ourſelues muſt firſt bee condemned god ſhould bee counted ryghteouſe wee ryghteouſe thing ſhould hee haue ryghteouſneſſe common intermedled men wee bee vtterly conuicted man dareth exempt himſelf cōtrariwiſe willingly yeld ourſelues gilty reſort goodneſſe god knowing belongeth iuſtifie v bycauſe fountayne righteouſneſſe ryght acknowledging bee righteouſe vvherfore let v learne ſhewed v generall rule faythfull giuen mortal man holy ghoſt deſirouſe publiſh god goodnes ſhewed v forgiuing v ſinnes behoueth v make confeſſion mouthe ſaluation according alſo sainct paule ſayeth tenth romaynes beleuing hart maketh v righteouſe confeſsing mouthe maketh v ſafe ſainct paule good faythfull expounder preſente text ſayd afore wee begin mouth bee wynd ſmoke therfore muſt firſt beleeue hart ſay muſt gather ourſelues vnto god enter owne conſciences therewithall bethinke v promiſes wee may flee vntoo vnto mere mercy refuge done mouthe muſt followe next confeſsion mouth bee ſaluation wee ſhall haue ſo beleeued hart vnto righteouſneſſe yet notwithſtanding theſe two thing muſt bee matched togither according wee ſee inſeparable wheras ſayd haue ſinned haue turned away goodneſſe hath profited mee holy ghoſt ſheweth v confeſsion muſt bee pure freeharted muſt ſpeake halues hypocrite ſay true world ſinfull men faulty ſo owne ſeeming wel quit surely dallying ſort god wee muſt ſet foorth ſinnes vttermoſt ſay wee muſt feele bee intollerable burthen according alſo wee ſee daniell doeth ſaying lord wee haue ſinned addeth wee haue delt wickedly wee haue trayterouſly tranſgreſſed lawe wee haue beene wilfull froward cauſe doeth daniell packe ſo many word togither make ſuch heape ſhewe v ſuch diſcharge themſelues ſo lyghtly godward ſpeaking word fault away hypocrite neuer felt offence thē let v marke wel ſuperfluitie text eliu hee ſhewed ſinner quit god hand cōfeſſe fault ſayth haue ſinned alſo addeth haue turned away goodneſſe vvherin hee doeth v vnderſtand man muſt ſtick confeſſe det fully ſay haue bene vtterly froward maliciouſe haue bin giuen wickedneſſe haue ſtrayed 〈◊〉 cleane waye ſaluation haue 〈…〉 elf againſt god haue giuen myſelfe wholy vntoo satan much thus ye ſee wee muſt deale wit countenaunce ſake ſo hart ſpeke god mouthe alſo agree confeſſe men wee haue felt within ourſelues effect thing ſhewed v let v apply ſelues cōſider entraunce giue vnto god lay forth treaſures goodneſſe towards v man ſhall ſee nothing throughout hardneſſe hart ſhameleſſeneſſe many theſe dayes humble thēſelues nay cōtrariwiſe al wild beaſts thoſe bee moſt faultie leaſte aſhamed mainteyne wickedneſſe ſet vp briſtles againſt men whēſoeuer go amend thē yet notwithſtanding theſe men ceaſe vaunt themſelues goſpell reformacion nothing worth thē yet apcee chriſtians firſt leſſon wee ought beare mind namely wee may inlightened knowe wrath god feele haynouſe ſinnes ſo may bee ſory vtterly aſhamed wee may imbrace god mercy take hold ende reconciled lord ieſus chriſts ſake meane deth paſsion finally confeſſe wretchedneſſe men ende whole prayſe may bee yeelded vnto god meete ſhould beholde ſay wherevnto wee ought inure ſelues haue touched afore men haue done amiſſe lyghtely greeuouſly ſo one becommeth drunkard another whoremayſter third ſwearer fourthe full malice crueltie another beater ſeeks nothing hand man ſhewed fault ſhall ſee wild beaſts meanes tamed make skorne warning giuē ſcarcely one amongs ten whiche hathe ſuch lowlineſſe modeſtie confeſſe fault hee hath done amiſſe seing ſo ſhet gate againſt god reiect grace offered v goſpell ſhort cannot abyde god ſhould forgiue ſinnes ſo wee ſee preaching goſpell vnto many men muſt bereue excuſe drown thē deepe hell bicauſe could make profit neuertheleſſe holy ghoſt prouoketh v receue exhortacion made vnto v vvherfore let v fight againſt pride hypocriſie v two thing keepe v humbling ourſelues god confeſsing fault men hypocriſie maketh v labour cōtinually cloke ſinnes pretēd giue ourſelues vnto goodneſſe meane whyle hart farre go cleane contrary way againe pride maketh v deſire always good reputacion ala ſeke eſteemed among men leaſtwiſe kepe ourſelues reproche although know owne ſinnes yet loth told thē meane whyle behold condemnacion increaſeth doubleth god angel therfore let v learne tame pride vntill fully ſubdewed ſo wee may come god humilitie cōfeſſe wretchedneſſe alſo indeuer edifie neighbour mā demand cauſe ſhuld ſpeake ſo men two reaſons one god might bee knowne bee righteouſe haue ſayd grace might appeare ſhyne forth although god could forbeare confeſsion yet notwithſtanding hee haue openly manyfeſtly knowne det ſee impoſsible knowe goodneſſe towards v wee vtterly caſt downe euen point diſpaire thus ye ſee firſt reaſon wee ought confeſſe neighbour goodneſſe haue felt god hād hee hath deliuered v frō death frō deſtruction wherin plunged alſo ſecond reſon men ſhould edified example haue bin exerciſed affliction god hath bin ſo gratiouſe deliuer mee good ſhould knowe god ſhal afflict may think themſelues behold god hand vpon ſummoneth drunckē ſinnes ſtray beaſt ſee intendeth drawe home ſet mee waye ſaluation therfore good men ſhould warned god working wee haue felt ſelues according ſee deede confeſsions whiche faithfull haue made tymes paſt ſerue daye learning wee example dauid greate number afflictiōs hee felt ouercame ſoone wee felt ſmall aduerſitie wee ſhould forthwith bee point diſpayre wee ſee iſſewe good profitable vnto dauid confeſſeth haue bin neceſſarie thing bee ſo afflicted chaſtized god hand wee alſo doo truſt god flee vnto aſſuring ſelues office raiſe men graue hee hath caſt wee confeſſe ſinnes report god hath viſited v rigor time afterward quickned v againe ſerueth inſtruct neighbour may bee nouices thinke ſtraunge god ſhall viſit turne haue ſayd may know themſelues wretched ſinners ſeeke remedie putting truſt death paſsion lord ieſus chriſt ſtirred vp ſerue honor ſhal haue felt goodnes grace experiēce hath receyued ſo mercy thus ye ſee thing ſhewed vnprofitable hū dred edified inſtructed example one mā therfore let v learne put away retchleſneſſe whē lord ſhall haue ſhewed v fauour ſo wee may magnifie goodneſſe men ſame may bee preached one common accord afterward ſaid concluſion hath deliuered ſoule pit life entring graue truely cannot bee throughly diſpatched muſt ſuffize v haue ſhort abridgement neede requireth ioyning parte haue declared already diſcourſe hath bin made cōfeſsing ſinnes mē ought aſhamed cōdemne thēſelues afterward behoueth thē immediatly adde praiſe god haue knowne goodneſſe therfore ſaid haue ſinned haue turned away frō goodneſſe yea hath booted god hath drawne pit thē aſſone holy ghoſt hath taught v acknowledge wretchednes aſhamed haue v immediatly preache god mercy according haue felt ſuffred v periſh muſt need haue helped v let v marke wel ſayd vnto ſinners ſhal boote thē reſiſt maker ſhal gaine hyde ſinnes thinke vpō thē rather nouriſh fond ſelfelyking ala ala alwayes greater deſtruction god diſcouereth iniquity maketh v feele thē doth procure profit therein prouoketh v reſort vnto thus ye ſee firſt point haue marke ſtreyne lette v marke alſo god ſhaketh v layeth wickedneſſe charge remedy wee muſt forlorne vntill god pitifull v receyue v mercie therfore whenſoeuer god forgiueth ſinnes one rayſed v frō death ſo wee muſt conclude wee ſo reconciled vntoo god hath hee wrought reſurrection v vve dead hope lyfe reſpect ſelues reacheth hand make v alyue agayne drawe v vnto lette v learne magnify grace forgiueneſſe ſinnes acknowledging god doth rayſe v life often pleaſeth receyue v mercy foraſmuch ſee satan ceaſſeth thruſt v ſo great benefite let v ſo much inflamed prouoked exalt highly deſerueth lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgemente ſinnes praying ſo exerciſe v iudgementes knowledge wretchedneſſe may alwayes learne ſerue honour yeeld ourſelues true humilitie may ſtrengthened mercy truſt thervnto ſettle ourſelues wholly vpon therby may learne confeſſe men howe gratious good god hath bene vnto v receyuing v mercy ende prayſe ſaluation may yelded vnto alone dewe may ſo aſhamed abaſhed ſelues onely may exalted v bee humbled vnder yeeld due honor homage dooing heereof may pleaſe rayſe vp true faythfull miniſters worde ſeeke c cxxviij sermon ſeuenth vpon xxxiij chapter first vpon xxxiiij chapter 29 behold god doth theſe thing thryce man 30 • avve backe ſoule graue may inlightened vvith light life 31 marke iob heare mee holde thy peace vvill ſpeake 32 thou haue matter anſvvere ſpeake deſire iuſtifie thee 33 heare mee hold thy peace vvill teach thee vviſedome xxxiiij chapter 1 eliu ſpake agayne ſayde 2 vviſe men heare vvordes men vnderſtanding hearken vnto 3 eare tryeth vvordes mouth iudgeth meates haue ſeene heretofore howe god prouideth welfare aſmuch wretched creature ne parte muſte fayne remedy vice elſe hope v yee ſee wee bee vtterly forlorne vndone god haue pitie vpon v meane hath bin declared vnto v namely teacheth v receyue grace ſomtimes chaſticements giueth v ſomtimes affliction great ſtripes roddes ſee dull ſlow ſtriketh harder ſo cōpelled come vnto bicauſe wee vtterly quayled hold longer heerevpon cōforteth v ſuch wiſe may come vnto call vpon feele fauorable v hauing felt ſuch grace acknowledge ſame ſight men cōfirmed ourſelues alſo cōfirme neighbour eliu hauing treated addeth one time god iuſtifieth v ſort reneweth ſayd inſtructiō oftentimes forſomuch wee bee ſo good ſchollers profite ſufficiently firſte day god faine hold mortifying affectiōs v may draw v humbling cōforting v againe done would forget returne owne nature wold ſuch ſtrength v walke becommeth v thus haue meening eliu rather holy ghoſt neceſſary doctrine v beſides papacie men haue buryed rightuouſneſſe commeth free gifte whereby god ſaueth v haue bene alſo ſomewhat modeſt men haue darkened intangled doctrine ſuche wiſe haue thought ynough ſay god iuſtifieth v goodneſſe ſay ſame whē ſo recōciled vnto thenceforth lyeth v deſerue keepe poſſeſsion grace whiche haue receyued meane bring man vtter deſpayre oure lord reach v hand onely ſet v good way pray ſhal able hold end conſidering frailtie fleſh whereof haue much proofe alſo grace god werevnauaylable v continued v end renewed time time neede requireth furthermore ſee fleſh luſty although haue beene tamed whyle wee ſeeme bee throughly diſpoſed beare yoke ſeeking nothing obey god ſo wonder ſhoulde changed one thing yet notwithſtanding rebelliouſneſſe hid within v auaunceth ſelfe satan knoweth meanes howe thruſt v way commeth beguyle v ſlightes vvhat ſhould become v thē god ſhould correct v euer let v alone ourſelues ſhould become v ſhould cōfort v one daye euer let v ſhift ſelues comfort receyued surely woulde euery whit fade away yea euen hande ſo needefull god ſhould begin new agayne euery inſtant conſidering returne naughtineſſe rod ſo well printed v make v remember requiſite earneſt call vpon leuer gad aboute wander away oure owne vanity ſteade ſeeking oure ſaluation wee bee harried heere wittes ſo wauering cannot reſte ſhoulde therefore continually roue abroade without ceaſſing whereas eliu ſetteth three tune meeneth many time manner holy scripture vvhiche determine certayne number ſhew profite god ſhoulde afflict v ſort variable inconſtant therfore behoueth returne vnto v agayne againe el thing ſhal haue done wil ſerue purpoſe cōfirmeth matter delt withall whē god hath deliuered ſoules graue quickned v light life ſweetening rigor chaſtiſements feele hand cannot ſhun vttermoſt power bicauſe cōtrary nature vve woulde fayne god ſhoulde handle v owne lyking hee ſhoulde neuer bee roughe v wee might neuer diſquieted mindes might alwayes liue eaſe would alwayes mainteyne v mirth reſte yea verely according haue ſayde good god ſhould handle v owne fancie hee ſhould vſe diſcretion ſend v whatſoeuer thinketh expedient v thē let v haue eye ende iſſue affliction may cōfort v ſay may ſerue ſalues medecines marke one poynt therefore although bitter firſt ſight yet let v receyue god hande knowing recordes loue hee hath care v woorke oure ſaluation beholde ſay thing ought appeaſe grudgings ſo ſhoulde impacient god chaſtizeth v ſo profite ſhoulde ſo neuertheleſſe ynough knowe affliction ſerue v medicine behooueth v alſo conſider diſeaſe like better man bee ſicke ſome ſmall light cōmon diſeaſe yet like well thing ſhall remedie hee wholly giuen ouer taken dead man yet recouer hee ſet ſtore remedy giuen euē ſo thing eliu ſheweth hee ſayeth god afflicting v doth remedy vice alſo fetch v graue quicken v hereby ſheweth vndone vtterly drowned deſtruction except god plucke v backe vnto euen violent meanes ſure coulde none otherwiſe bee conſidering hardhartedneſſe rather ſo ſnarled ſinnes cānot eaſily woūd seing god rayſeth v agayne according treated large yeſterday let v aſſure ſelues wee cannot ſufficiently eſteeme goodneſſe hee ſheweth v pleaſeth chaſtize v therefore ſecond poynt haue marke third muſt nedes paſſe way ſayth intent draw backe▪ betokeneth inforcing neceſsitie true god could well ſaue v without meane diſputing god mightie power eliu hath reſpect oure ſtate alſo poynt muſt reſt vpon therfore let v learne god ſhold deale gently v let v alone quiet might ſleepe oure ſinnes without waking woulde cauſe deſtruction nedefull ſhoulde handled ſuch rigor oftentimes yea bare frailtie feebleneſſe ſhould faine vſe farre greater roughneſſe towards v therfore howſoeuer man afflicted ought beare paciētly aſſuring himſelfe god doth without cauſe euen without neceſſary cauſe alſo therwithall haue marke cōpariſon ſet betwene graue lighte life vvhat god draweth v backe death doth bring v light life yee ſee one ſide extreme miſerie yee ſee alſo one ſide ſouerayne benefite therfore let v learne god ſuffer v folow luſts make haſt alwaies towards graue ſay nothing plundge ourſelues vtter deſtruction cā neuer get agayne lo mā would god ſhould giue bridle hereby haue good cauſe miſlike ourſelues cōſidering frowardnes v true euery one v wil ſay deſirous go vnto god attayne ſaluation meane looke vpon life looke vpon thought looke vpon whole doings ſeeme mad ſeeking owne deſtruction wee ceaſſe prouoke wrath god ſhould ſay coulde neuer come ſoone ynough depth miſery seeing ſo giuen euill nature though wee deſyrous periſhe wilfully let euery man learne knowe himſelfe miſlike himſelfe therevpon ſuffer god gouerne ſeeyng owne guyding gouernment ſo wretched vnhappy let v forget fooliſhe preſumptions wherewith worlde ſo ſotted euery man thinkes himſelf wiſe ynough may haue owne free lo howe men deceyue themſelues making themſelues beleue haue greate ſtore wiſedome ſtrength contrariwiſe ſee god neede correct force curſed affection deſiring knowe meete v therwithall ſide let v cōſider whervnto god calleth v draweth v backe graue light life ſetteth v ſome middle ſtate ſay ye ſhall ſtarke dead ye ſhall lā guiſh hee calleth v light lyfe wit neweneſſe whereby regenerated incorruptible heauenly lyfe matter concerneth god deliuering v onely death alſo bringing v euerlaſting kingdome although walke many corruption bylowe beſet round yea dwell v euen bone maree yet god guyde gouerne v euen till wee come kingdome thus ye ſee cōpariſon cōfirmeth yet better infinite gracious goodneſſe god end ſhould ſtirred ſeeke ſhall haue brought v right way indeuer ſelues go forwarde day day hee ſhall haue drawne v backe ſuffer teach v deſire continue teaching ſtyll withall let v marke alſo muſte diſcouraged though oftentimes fall backe ſeeme clyue aſunder god hath ſet v good trade throughly tamed vice fleſhe happen nowe get vpper hande v ſo driuen infirmitie groweth misbeleefe ſo couered darkeneſſe let v therfore heart ſayde god worke many time man intent bring light lyfe therefore come vnto god haue ſure hope ſaluation fall trouble anguiſh ſo ſuddayne ſtorme ſeemeth ouerwhelme v let v therfore ceaſe truſt god ſayde beginne woorke new agayne v ſhould giue ſelues brydle lette v beware meane ſhoulde put vre ſaying prophet eſay whiche ſtrengthen quaking legges cheere vp faynting heart man bee ſtrong deſpyſing god making accounte grace neede feele god iudgementes ſmitten hard wounded quicke feeble trembling ſo knee quake haue ſtrength v propertie nature goſpell ſtrengthen v againe according ſayd prophet eſay ſuch haue charge teach church commaunded ſtrengthen weake legges cheere vp faint hart cheriſh vp trembling knee seeing ſo behoueth v follow ſame order according alſo apoſtle applieth euery faithfull man prophete eſay ſpoken ſuch publike charge teach apoſtle epiſtle hebrewes ſheweth euery man ought owne teacher behalfe let v looke ſelues wee bee aſtoniſhed god iuſtice lette caſte v wicked imagination make v fall deſpayre wee feele oure knee tremble armes legges good broken ſo afflicted know yet lette v therefore ceaſſe ſtrengthen ſelues day day eliu hauing ſpoken ſo addeth iob heare mee giue good eare leastwiſe thou haue matter agaynste mee ſtoppe thy mouthe ſpeake thou haue wherewith iustifie thy ſelfe hold thy peace heare mee ſpeake teache thee wiſedome deſire iustifie thee ſhoulde ſay would fayne thou ſhouldeſt quitte thou haue good auaylable defence bring forth lette thy mouth bee ſhet nowe againe warned iobs perſon keepe ſilence god truth ſet afore v replie agaynſt profitable warning conſidering hardneſſe heart pryde men exceeding harde v ſubmit ſelues vnto god vvee ſee bee alwayes ſtriuings v oure mindes framed ſuche lowlineſſe ought bee man alleadge v good holye thing ſo mylde receyue haue ſuche pryde wee loth bee ſubiect thing owne yee ſee nature men lift vp themſelues agaynſt god alwayes kicke agaynſt worde sith ſubiect ſuch wicked curſed vice let v marke well warning giuen v vvhich teachable god cauſeth men tell v truth iames meeneth ſayeth behooueth v receyue god woorde meeke ſpirite without cauſe hath expreſſed meane vvould ſhew profite god worde behoueth v aboue thing haue meeke gentle ſpirite fierce courage ſurely ſhall turne euill neuer finde taſte god worde ouerthrow goodneſſe light ſhall turned darkeneſſe vvhat done vve muſt keepe ſilence god ſpeaketh neuertheleſſe muſt looke ſhall ſhew himſelfe viſibly heauen often worde preached ſet forth vnto v muſt hold true good aſſuring ourſelues proceedeth frō reply againſt make warre agaynſt mortal creature aduaunce ourſelues diueliſh preſūption agaynſt liuing god therfore behooueth v hold peace may taught finally whole true wiſedome men yeelde themſelues teachable vnto god ſubmit themſelues wholly ſhewed name authoritie firſt point haue marke exhortation eliu maketh vnto iob ſpeaking vnto man ſuch wiſe vnder perſon v warned duety haue ſayde already aboue thing let v marke behoueth v keepe ſilence ſpoken god iuſtice reproued ſinnes thus ye ſee circumſtance haue yet marke ouer beſides hath bene ſayd already vvhat eliu treated hitherto ſhewed vntoo iob god ryghtuous yea ſuch ſort men ought wholly gouerned draw backe graue bring vnto life holding continually mighty hande till haue brought perfection therin men moſt beguile thēſelues vvhy ſo men cānot glorifie god take ſhame themſelues wyll alwayes chalenge ſomewhat themſelues although ought know owne lewdneſſe bee aſhamed yet notwithſtanding alwayes puffed vp ſome preſumption dazeled ſome vayne fancie ſaying haue haue although perfectly rightuouſe yet vtterly deſtitute goodneſſe thus yee ſee men deſirous reſerue ſomewhat themſelues cannot yeeld vp vnto god cauſe wee cannot fully receyue doctrine free iuſtification ſheweth v god receyueth v meere mercy accepting v reſpect owne workes altogither ſinfull bycauſe pleaſeth waſhe v clenze v bloud onely ſonne hold v acknowledge v child notwithſtāding nature nothing v wretchedneſſe curſedneſſe cauſe eliu hauing ſhewed much wee bound vnto god thing haue ſo much honor ought yeelded vnto beginner performer all▪ addeth men ſhoulde giue eare hold peace according alſo paule ſayth third romanes alledged one theſe dayes paſte nowe eliu ſayeth deſirous haue iob quit thereby hee ſheweth went fierce contentious minde mē wont wil mainteyne cōtrary part purpoſe grieue man would faine iob could haue mainteyned rightuouſneſſe ſith hath wherewith would haue hūble himſelfe god let v marke eliu ſpeaketh inſtrumēt god ſpirit hereby let v take warning whēſoeuer god thūdreth agaynſt v holy ſcripture coueteth deſtructiō bereeuing v thing belōgeth vnto v thogh enuied v ſomething worthy prayſe hurt ſhould god whit diminiſhed hauing ſome truth ſide foraſmuch behoofe vtterly throwne downe bicauſe cannot receiue benefite offreth v vnleſſe quite clean voyde preſumption vanitie therfore bereeueth v firſt vayneglory ſheweth v haue nothing ſhame reproch v infected rotten filthineſſe god ſay fayne bring v poynt grieued rightuouſneſſe well knowne faulte bicauſe profite remayneth v humble ſelues receyue promiſes giuen v ſaluation foraſmuch diuell eggeth v ſtray obedience god harkening quietly vnto let v brydle mindes yea let v brydle ſhort ſay yet muſt thy god raygne ouer thee thy maiſter thou muſte bee ſcholler receyue whatſoeuer deliuered thee name lo heere effect haue remember concerning exhortation eliu maketh vnto iob heerevpon may alſo gather haue touched already namely ſhall neuer profite till haue learned hold peace holding peace whereof eliu ſpeaketh wee ſhoulde wiſe owne conceite ſuttle reply againſt god ſay howe wee muſte contented whiche god ſheweth v bycauſe obedience pleaſeth beſte thing ſo yee ſee chiefe poynt faith quiet godward whē men ſo preſumptious take vppon theyr owne reaſon conclude vppon thing whiche ought ſtande vnto ſurely god wyll blinde muſt needes puniſh ſuch pryde vvhat bee done wee commaunded keepe ſilence ſay beate downe pryde oure nature ſo may thinke ſelues haue wiſdome owne may ſeeke god hand ſuffer teach v may profite let v come eliu addeth generall ſayeth heare mee ye wiſe men giue care mee yee men vnderstanding mouth iudgeth meates whether bee ſauery eare tryeth woordes eliu doth firſte tell v aduertiſe v doctrine onely rude ignorant alſo men therefore man muſt hold skorne though learned inough already wiſeſt may confirmed finde looſe theyr time harkening whiche ſayde conteyned vndoubtedly knewe v would attentiue heare doctrine dayly preached vnto v firſte thruſting away god wee take skorne taught though hee ordeyned vnprofitable thing beholde god goſpel ſhould preached men ſhould heare giue eare vntoo hath ſayde ought bee done ignorant ſuch ſtill theyr apcee ſpoken whole bodie church inſomuch haue great ſmall followe rule paule ſheweth muſte continue order till bee come perfect age euen age lord ieſus chriſt ſhall finde perfect man founde mortall life muſte bereft mortall body god muſte haue taken v home himſelfe wee come perfection ſeeing god wil whole body church ſhoulde taught yea euen perfecteſt excellenteſt ſorte ſhall lewde ouerweening wee beare men inhande doctrine ſuperfluous v wee haue neede lette v looke vppon example paule mirrour angelike holyneſſe yet notwithſtanding hee ſayeth indeueed ſtill go forward dayly vvhen neere death foughten valiauntly honour god yet ſtil hee forgatte hee doone afore althoughe hee ſerued god faythfully ſuffered manye thing name ſake yet notwithſtanding hee eye alwayes vpon remayning ſayde muſt regarde haue doone one thing meane fall aſleepe indeuer ſelfe paſſe muſt keepe forwarde ſtreyne ſelfe come remayneth herein ſay paule ſheweth v well wee haue doo lette v marke muſte nice ſhake doctrine ſet afore v though coulde ſerue v purpoſe though learned ynough already heere ſpirite god exhorteth wiſe men men moſt vnderſtanding heare receyue thing ſayde therefore wee ſee god wiſedome ſo infinite neuer throughly comprehended long men liue worlde ynough haue ſome taſt profite dayly ſide let v marke wel wee haue learned thing wee keepe ill forget hande therefore wee neede put minde god ſo gratious vnto v ſet mercie afore v ende ſhould vtterly deſperate paſte hope truſting vnderſtanding thing brayne wee haue muſt ouer printed hart doctrine ſpeculatyue gaze men may terme humane ſciences ynough haue conceyued muſte rooted heartes let v conſider whether haue ſuch beleefe god wee neede dayly put minde ſhewed ſo concluded wiſe men men vnderſtanding counſelled harken giue eare thereby ſayde loftineſſe muſt layde downe muſte intend taught god ſo much muſte follow rule giuen v heere bicauſe wee ſee world findeth taſt god worde ignorant bicauſe knowe ſhet dores loth time come good doctrine fickleheaded aſſoone heare ſome woorde glaunce thinke themſelues bee ſo greate clarkes haue ynough therevpon ouerpaſſe according wee ſee muche experience theſe dayes howe many haue eares ſtopped although woorde god dayly ſounde foorth ſo might partaker doctrine lyfe ſaluation yet notwithſtanding make none account haue taſte ſome ſeene hauing vnderſtoode ſome ſmall thing goſpell doo beare themſelues hande ſo great clarkes neede heare vvhat number theſe fantaſticall lightheaded chriſtians ſay vnderſtoode truth thus many yeeres ago ſince knewe goſpell knowe man may well eate fleſh vpon frydayes man bounde ſhriue himſelfe therevpon fall babling mingle curſed blaſphemies ſlender thing know wote howe hilde skorne taught god ſchoole ſomuch ſee god doth ſo puniſh men negligence wee ought take heede doctrine marke well howe salomon ſayeth wiſe men ſhal grow continually wiſedome hearing god ſo puniſhe negligence ouerſight men ſhall become theyr pryde ſhet gate wilfully agaynſt good doctrine conceyuing diſdayne agaynſt ſwell like toades ſo wiſe bee taught eliu hath exhorted wiſe men men vnderſtanding heare addeth reaſon mouth ſayeth doth ſerue tast meates eare trie iudge woordes hereby betokeneth ſuch diſdayne giue eare god truth taught ſeeke confirmed thing haue heard already peruerte order nature become monſters woorſe brute beaſtes beaſt followeth owne kinde behold man whiche ſhall call himſelfe wiſe hauing reaſon diſcretion created image god inlightened truthe ſhall notwithſtanding gyue minde dayly eate drinke profit god woorde hath point cōmon brute beaſts bee nouriſhed foode ſeeke man woulde excellent angle heauen doth notwithſtāding giue himſelf wholly eating drinking like beaſt meane ſeaſon vouchſafeth vſe eares whiche hee hath receyued noble pretious intent eating drinking theſe ſerue maynteyne v tranſitory life ſerue giue v hope euerlaſting life ſaluation man vſe ſuche gift god muſte eſteemed monſter agaynſt nature haue ſayde double beaſt ſee elius meening hee ſayeth v freendes man refuſe bee taught marke doth god created v hee gaue v mouth taſt meates intent ſhould receyue foode dayly hand ſame benefite ought eſteeme lorde nouriſheth v principall benefite hee gaue v eares alſo purpoſe taught communicate one another onely buying bootes ſhooes cappes bread wine vſe tongue eares yet noble wit leade v truth meane god woord might know created incorruptible paſſed world heritage prepared v aboue ſhorte bring v vnto god fayth commeth hearing ſayeth sainct paule seeing god hath ordeyned eares ſo excellent vſe lifte v vp heauen beholde god behold father witneſſe vnto v hee receyueth v child ſowe ſeede incorruptible life v middes corruption v ſeeing ſay wee may obtaine ſuch benefite eare ſhoulde wee play deafe men ſtop eares men ſpeake vnto v tell v truth know ſaluatiō ouergreate beaſtlineſſe ſo muſte man boaſt perfectneſſe wiſedome vnderſtanding cannot abyde taught contrariwiſe worſe beaſts worlde haue ſhewed althoughe ſentence ſelfe haue neede long expoſition yet notwithſtanding wee haue neede bee quickned ſtyrred vp knowe ſee cace wee bee euery man buſie ynough thing concerne preſent lyfe owne ſaluation glory god man cannot bring v thinke vpon vvee carefull ynough eate drinke onely dreſſe three foure houres aforehand alſo make prouiſion long time afore yea euen foure liues men haue ſo greate care compaſſe tranſitorie goodes end may neuer haue want euer hand although haue inough find life yet beare themſelues hand ſhoulde wante euen theyr deathe yee ſee howe gyuen tranſitory thing world without cōſidering god hath created v brute beaſts haue giuen v excellent thing bodie hope eternall life looke seing nature ſo brutiſh wee haue ſo muche neede marke whiche ſhewed v wit ſeeing god hath created faſhioned v parte v nother body ſoule idle al ought applyed ſome vſe wee ought make thoſe thing auaylable god hath giuen v seeing alſo ſo buzied earthly care ſome 〈…〉 arre themſelues eating drinking alwayes gluttony riot ſome buſie pinching gathering deſire nothing heape vp ſome followe theyr whoredome ſome ambition get eſtimation credite worlde let v bethinke ſelues better seeing hilde ſo faſt beneath bee done let v indeuer turne away theſe pluckings backe conſider wherfore eye made onely beholde thing may ſerue life luſt bicauſe fleſhe liketh well chiefeſt cauſe ſhould behold god workes whereby calleth v wherefore eares made onely haue intercourſe one another worldly matter buſineſſe ende might bee taught come vnto god ſticke wholly vnto atteine heauenly glory seing middes corruption body lorde hath ſet meanes bring v ſayde incorruptible benefite namely giuing v ſenſe hearing oughte put vſe doo ſo ſurely wee ſhall haue excuſe nother muſt alledge manie men caſte foorth namely skill god woorde high darke mee cannot faſten vpon yea ſo wee diſtruſt god giueth v witte diſcretion receyue thing ſaluation hath promiſed v teach lowly therefore let v diſtruſt owne ſenſes confeſſe wee wretched beaſtes inlighten v holy ſpirite let v truſt promiſſe hath giuen namely wil ſcholemaſter humble meeke inſtruct ſaluation ſo ſuffer ourſelues gouerned bring v right way hee hath ſet v hee make v go forwarde although wee bee nowe thruſte yet hee ſet v agayne although wee fall yet hee lifte v vp hande thus yee ſee ſtyll wee haue marke texte ſayde onely eare ſhal heare ſay created heare alſo ſayd ſhall iudge wordes matter eliu ſhould ſay lord hath giuen v opening eares receiue doctrine told v poyſon end receyue doctrine ſerueth ſpirituall feeding ſoules like receyue breade wine afrayde eate drinke though wiſt whether poyſon true muſt beware poyſon pray god preſerue v men ſo fooliſhe ſtarue themſelues forbeare eating drinking feare leaſt theyr foode bee poyſoned skill meate diſceme whether poyſoned let v vnderſtand lorde hath giuen v vſe eares ende ſhoulde bee afrayde receyue doctrine bycauſe wee thinke high darke v behoueth v pray god giue v ſpirite diſcretion iudgement ende may apply thing profite whiche ſhall bee declared v worde therwithall ſo gouerne v holy ſpirite wee may bee skilfull diſcerne thing good profitable let v fal downe face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may learn ſory thē withdraw ſelues theſe earthly thing contented viſited hande maner way acknowledging ſelues ſo wretched miſerable creature deſerue well bee vtterly ouerwhelmed yet forbearing reſorte mercy aſſuring ſelues hee ready receyue v fauour therfore deſiring make v cō tinually taſt goodneſſe ende paſsing affliction worlde wee may ceſ • e comforted reioyce bliſſe holy name fith hath ſhewed ſelfe father sauiour towards v may pleaſe graunt grace v c cxxix sermon whch ſecond vpon xxxiiij chapter 4 let v chooze iudgement conſider among ſelues vvhat beſt 5 iob hath ſayde rightuous god hath ouerthrovven right 6 alſo lier right mine arrovve greeuous vvithout ſinne 7 vvhat man like iob drinketh skornfulneſſe vvater 8 vvalketh vvith vvorke iniquitie vvalketh vvith vvicked 9 ſayeth man ſhall pleaſe god vvalking vvith 10 therefore ye men vnderſtanding heare ye mee god forbid ſhould vvickedneſſe god naughtineſſe almightie cace ſtandeth vppon yeelding account life muſte looke haue iudge god notwithſtanding appeale giue ſentence v according owne knowledge vayne v reply wee ſhall gayne nothing howbeeit aſmuche muche men rebellious finde theyr heart confeſſe god rightuous except compelled god vſeth maner ſpeach holy ſcripture cōtented togo lawe v ſhall bee ſome meane iudge agreed vpon betwixte v ſuche thing done ende ſhoulde reproued conuicted although wee might go lawe yet would auayle v whit hee ſpeaketh maner prophete eſay lette v chooze men ſayeth hee iudge betwixt mee true haue ſaid reaſon god ſhoulde abace himſelfe ſo farre meening ſhewe although wee libertie cyte pleade cace agaynſte yet ſhoulde wee alwayes ouercome ſame maner doth deale text eliu ſayeth lette v chooze iudgement according hee proteſted heeretofore would afrayde ſpeake foraſmuche iob complayned god abaſhed maieſtie hee hearing thervpon eliu ſayeth go ſo fray thee thou ſhouldeſt colourably alleadge reaſon thee come peaceably thee ſhall lawful thee ſpeake thou liſteſt thou haſte thing defend thy ſelfe withall alledge bring foorth lette bee debated nowe wee haue naturall ſenſe texte let v ſee howe wee apply inſtruction firſte wee haue gather althoughe god haue power ouer v yet notwithſtanding hee iudgeth v ſuche vprightneſſe fault founde although wee leaue pleade cace yet ſhoulde wee bee put ſhame whiche hath bene handled ſundry time heretofore namely god vttereth power agaynſte v manner tyrante putteth difference betweene good badde intendeth trie vttermoſte power god hath ſuch lawleſſe power yee might terme power infinite ſo doings indifferent rightfull true wee doo alwayes perceyue reaſon woorkes neyther oughte rightuouſneſſe bee inclozed within ſo ſmall meaſure vnderſtanding yet notwithſtanding behooueth v alwayes fully perſwaded poynt god ſuche wiſe mightie hee diſpozeth thing iuſtice vprightneſſe furthermore lette v preſume call lawe lette v aſſure ſelues wee muſte thing yeelde ſelues gilty herewithall let v marke alſo lybertie pleade would profite wee ſhoulde alwayes founde guiltie although iudged v yet would owne cōſcience condemne v therefore let v learne humble ſelues god know hath ſuch power ouer v may iuſtly confounde ouerwhelme v yea ſuch rightfulneſſe ſhal haue one worde anſwere hee cannot diſproue liſt lette v nowe come eliutreateth cheefely findeth fault iob complaining plague greeuous vndeſerued parte god ſo peruerted right driuen lyer although deede hee wherwith iuſtifie himſelfe yee ſee effect thing eliu chargeth iob withall lette v conſider whether iobs meening ſo haue declared heeretofore iobs meening directly blaſpheme god howbeeit exceeded meaſure paſsions herken iob amiſſe knoweth himſelfe ſinner hee confeſſeth himſelfe ſo neither ſaid god cauſe puniſh yet meane compared himſelf others thought god handled roughly thus chiefe thing wherein iob overſhot himſelfe conceyued ſuch rigor go 〈…〉 thought bee ouerſore ought haue preſſed ſo harde conſidering hee ſilie poore creature life ſtrength nothing ſmoke herein cannot excuſe haue told afore hādling good cace followed good order like aduerſaries dealing euill cace vſed good argument ſubſtātiall reaſons therefore concerning iob although rightfull cace yet hee miſguyde although hee pacient determined ſubmit himſelf vnto god yet reſtreyne paſsions exceſſe like chriſten man indeuereth tame himſelfe hold himſelfe pryſoner vnder obedience god cānot ſuch perfection meane ſhall feele fleſhe fighteth againſt ſpirite good would paule ſayth place ſpeaketh thoſe fleſhlye whiche giue themſelues brydle euill ſuch haue beſt zeale ſerue pleaſe god ſurely ſetteth forth himſelfe
