example ſaying although inforced himſelf aſmuch poſſible mortall man frame himſelfe wholly god yet able bring throughly paſſe temptation great violent iob impoſsible ſhould ſo cō ſtant ſhaken ſhould tickled ſuffer muche infirmitie battels wee haue agaynſt fleſhe vve ſee happened iacob hee wreſtled angell therfore called iſraell ſay preuailing god yet notwithſtanding halted fayne haue lame hip long liued ende might feele hee gotten victorie ſuche wyſe feebleneſſe example patterne v although god ſtrengthen v power ſo wee ouercome temptation yet ſame done without ſome markes infirmitie euen ſo happened vnto iob eliu doth iuſtly reprooue heere yet neuertheleſſe elius meening iob intended accuſe god directly vnrightuouſneſſe crueltie hee ſheweth ſo glorifie god rightuouſneſſe ought truely hee ſpeaketh roughly ſeemeth wreſt iobs wordes make worſer let v marke good reaſon holy ghoſt ſhould bewray vice v althogh ſeeme greate vnto v example iob confeſſeth generally god rightuous yea hee knowledgeth ſuch one euē perſon yet toſſe ſo roughly paſsions ſlipped ſay doth god puniſh mee ſort reaſon ſhoulde might pleade cace would ſhew haue deſerued ſhoulde bee ſo violent agaynſt mee suche wordes ſcaped iob without knowing ſayde howbeeit man examine meening worſt ſort onely caryed away pangues coulde ſhoulde ſo turmoyled paſsions skirmiſhe againſt god vvhy doth eliu reprooue ſuche rigor bycauſe leaſt doubt haue god rightuouſneſſe leaſt diſputing cā make blaſphemie though ſeeme ſo v let v marke wel thē holy ghoſt diſcouereth malady hidden ende ſhould vnderſtand whenſoeuer fancy come heade darken god rightuouſneſſe deface glory meanes although purpoſe yet horrible fault cannot condemne ynough nother venial ſinnes papiſts make ſay man doubte god rightuouſneſſe yea haue many curſed imagination running minde yet deadly ſinne ſo cōſent beaſtly doctrine yet among papiſtes men holde certayntie contrarywiſe let v marke well heere holie ghoſte thundreth agaynſte conceytes come thought although knowe ſo contrary god glorie ouer although minde directly accuſe god yet ſo intangled wicked thoughtes paſsions toſſe v fro ſo peacheable glorifie god obey reſpectes cannot bee excuſed deſerue bee reproued intended iuſtifie ſelues make god guyltie reſpect v wee charged iniquitie purpoſed mainteyne ſelues though faulte v ought warne v yeelde ſelues alwayes guyltie withoute diſputing haue deale god although ſhiftes myghte bee allowed men wont alſo fall aſleepe yet ende wee ſhall ſpyghte teeth feele god one woorde ouerthrowe long reply fayre colour wee ſhall pretende therefore come wicked thought diminiſh god glory make v doubte rightuouſneſſe let v learne knowe already entred blaſphemie wee greatly condemned yea though thoſe thought paſſe away hand mind reſt vpon agayne haue thought tendeth purpoſe accuſing god onely ſome intent iuſtifie ſelues againſt blaſphemie vvhat done let v learne confeſſe god rightuous condemne oure ſelues twoo thing cannot matche togither men ſhould go cleare themſelues therwithall able glorifie god becōmeth woorthy god neuer hath whole right except confounded thing quite cleane daſhed ſo wee haue defence agaynſte thing lefte v onely hang downe heades lo haue gather firſte place texte neuertheleſſe ende thing may bee better imprinted heartes let v marke howe eliu ſayeth iob walked wicked howe dooth eliu accuſe iob haue beene deſpyſer god man diſordered life ſeing heretofore proteſted walked ſuche perfection harde finde man like vnto wee haue ſeene hee eye blinde feete lame father fatherleſſe hād bin ſhet poore ſuffered ſides acold curſe houſe alwayes beene open ſuch neede bene freendly ſtrangers although credite yet hee neuer abuſed although might haue bene borne place iuſtice yet walked ſimply oppreſſed perſon howe doth eliu accuſe haue walked wicked according matter hath taken hand namely whē man replieth agaynſt iudgement god hee walketh therefore let v marke well although man nother whoremonger theef drunkard murtherer quareler yetnotwithſtāding fayleth acceſſary greateſt wickedneſſe hee glorifie god haue poynte pryde ſo hee cannot ſubmit himſelfe god iuſtice rightuouſneſſe goodneſſe yeelde god due honour wee wicked ſo although reſte life angelicall point ought marke well ſeeming man rightuous ſo cannot charged worldwarde haue led vertuous life meane thinke ſinne mā ſerue god ſuch humility ought vvhen wee haue yeelded neyghbours duetie god diſappoynted robbed due muſt therfore needes rightuous ſtill bee faultie robbing man deſerue euerlaſting death valewe fiue ſhillings rob god honour go aboute diminiſhe maieſtie much haynouſe crime robbery whoredomes murthers poyſonings periuries thing world let v marke well whereas eliu chargeth iob haue walked wicked mente vice apparant worldwarde hee whoremonger theefe glorified god acknowledging rightuous rather contrarywiſe intended condemne howbeit directly hee murmured agaynſt god reaſon torment miſerie althoughe ſayde impaciency mingled pacience yet notwithſtā ding reiected blaſphemie iob condemned euill doer heereby warned liuing without anoyance without working deceyte harme wrong neigbours muſt ſuch wiſe meane cheefe regard muſt god walke ſuche humilitie prayſe may alwayes ſound heartes mouthes may glorifie ſay heart tongue alike heartburning incomberance commeth mindes lette v yeelde ſelues guilty hand tary till condemned tyll god ſende v iudges pronounce open ſolemne ſentence againſt v nother let v tary till thunder heauen lette euery v acknowledge euill himſelfe miſlike euen leaſte flighteſt thoughtes enter oure imaginacions aſſuring ſelues bee horrible deadly ſinnes herewithal let v marke wel god fayle receyue v mercie ſobeit alſo readie willing condemne ſelues thoſe deale ſtubbornely needes diſpute checke ſhal find end wilfulneſſe ſhal ſerue purpoſe put double confuſion ſo wee ſee without cauſe god hath diſtinguiſhed lawe twoo table ſhewe v ſeruice honour owe goeth formeſt followeth duetie wee owe brother ſeruice god therefore muſt foundation whole life ſo muſt glorifie knowing ende wherevnto hee hath created v hee mainteyneth nouriſheth v worlde afterwarde according bound one v another wee muſte indeuer helpe ſerue neighbour without hurting man ye ſee haue remember text nowe alſo let v conſider manner ſpeach conteyned vvhereas eliu chargeth iob ſaying rightuous god hath ouerthrowne iudgement ment haue tolde afore iob intended ſo flatly ſhortly accuſe god ouerthrowing right let v marke manne doth ſo preciſely maynteyne owne right cannot without derogation god without aduauncing himſelfe agaynſt rightuouſneſſe therefore poynt well woorthie bee marked found v ſometime ſo bold ſay god hath ouerthrowne right herewithal let v marke well would faine rightuous enter extremitie according alſo paule ſpeaketh glorifying god confeſsing bee rightuous hee haue mouthes ſtopped long men reply whet tongue maynteyne owne rightuouſneſſe muſt needes haue god aduerſarie looke whenſoeuer god afflicteth cannot yeeld confeſſe rightuous ſo ſurely aduaunce themſelues agaynſt yee ſee haue wee haue god ſet himſelfe agaynſt v condemne v guiltie lifting vp ſelues agaynſt accuſing vnrightuouſneſſe vvee may well proteſt wee ſuch meening yet thing ſo deede ſhall wee gaine denying ſeeing holy ghoſt hath giuen determinate ſentence vpon thus much concerning firſt ſpeach conteyned wheras ſayde made lier mine owne right thereby ſignifieth hee admitted owne defence one ſome iudge vnreaſonable cruell would oppreſſe ſome good rightfull cace authoritie lo howe eliu dooth heere vpbrayde iob blaming god ſayd oh ſee pray muſt bee taken guiltie bycauſe god haue ſo heare mine owne defence hee preſſeth mee mouth ſtopped alledge reaſon take place admitted iob ment ſtep ſo farre boundes howbeeit herewithall let v beare minde hath beene ſayde wit acknowledge duetie ſimply one wee woulde ſay god vſeth tyrannicall power ouer v procedeth reaſon equitie diſpoſeth thing bicauſe bee pleaſure although mouth vtter ſuch woordes yea heart quake thinking yet notwithſtanding fully conclude defenſe v guiltie wee ſtill enter pleading againſt god wee muſt bee condemned defacers rightuouſneſſe touching ſayd immediatly iob drunke ſcornefulneſſe water ment ſo dulled hee perceyued woordes hee vſed vncomely worthie reiected hee deſerued bee ſcorned witleſſe man yet notwithſtanding wee haue ſeene iob ſpake many excellent ſayings yea inſtrument holy ghoſt ſo wee may gather great learning thing hee ſpake seeing ſo caſt teeth hee drunke ſcornefulneſſe water bycauſe mannes paſsions ſo inflamed knoweth ſpeaketh cannot muſt bee caried away ſort nowe befell vnto iob pray ſhall become v pacience ſet downe rule haue tolde ende ſheweth nothing better v abide good pleaſure god chaſtiſementes hee ſendeth v whatſoeuer yet al accuſed ſhameleſſe perſon drinketh lewdneſſe fiſhe ſucketh water layd charge rightly pray ſhall become v wee ſee ſelues hundred time impacienter hee needeth furtherance make v chafe fret agaynſt god ought wee thinke wee worſe dull wee ſee iobs perſone holy ghoſt ment ſhew v bee aduerſities comber v ouerſore frayltie feebleneſſe ſo mingled knowe become gnaſhe teeth chawe vpon brydle ſo ſtraught neyther keepe way path haue marke ſtreyne nowe let v come ſentence eliu addeth accuſeth iob haue ſayd profiteth man haue walked god walking god importeth man ſo giueth himſelfe ſeruice god thinketh continually giue account acknowledgeth himſelfe maner hath created formed gouerneth guideth cannot ſhun hand ſcape iudgement therefore muſt preſent eies ſo ſhall ſee workes alſo thought lo walke god holy ſcripture doth purpoſely vſe kinde ſpeech bicauſe mē like coliers ſacks ſay make one black experience ſheweth walke without hauing eie vnto god none v taketh libertie euill vnder ſhadow bad himſelf mean alſo giueth occaſion neighbor euill inſomuch day v giueth euill example ſome meanes vice v haue owne therefore walke men wee walke horrible confuzion life like hotchpotch darke dungeon ſo nothing diſcerned beholde ſay walke men done seeing walking worlde wee become worſe worſe euerie man draweth neighbor vnto euill himſelf foloweth faſt peruerting order remayneth nothing v gather v vnto god frame ſelues wholy vnto ſayd enock walked god bicauſe peruerted although whole worlde time corrupt might yet notwithſtanding enock continued vncorrupted wherof came bicauſe hee gathered wit gaue himſelfe bridle deale diſorderly although iniquitie water floud vpon earth yet knew behoued walk preſence god furthermore importeth alſo wee muſt regarde haue ſome fayre ſhewes many thinke ynough prayſed men abſteyn euill worldward haue cleare handes outward ſight ynough nothing worth except wee haue hart pure god therfore let v marke well holy scripture ſpeaketh walking god meeneth purpoſe haue framed outwarde lyfe ſuch ſort vice may appeare oure conſciences alſo muſt agree therewithall ſo bee cleane rid wicked frowarde affection thirdly walking god muſt bee frame oure ſelues wholy lawe lyfe bee allowed men wee flatter ourſelues good intent nothing according wee ſee popedome ſuche imagine themſelues moſt deuoute thinke god verie muche dette yet bycauſe deſpiſe holy scripture leane theyr owne inuentions whiche haue buylded aduenture traſh filthineſſe therefore let v marke wee liue well haue right certaine rule behoueth v walke god ſay walke vprightly muſt frame thought deed vnto cōmandements vnto men deuices owne imagination thus much concerning ſaying let v come principall poynt howe ment iob ſhoulde ſay ſhall ſtande man ſtead haue walked god bicauſe aſtraught torment knewe god aſsiſted hee ſerued conformed ruled life rightuouſneſſe true iob knew generally god rightuous muſt eſteeme meaſure rightuouſneſſe preſent ſtate worlde thing ſeene eies ye ſee alſo controuerſie againſt friend good men afflicted troubled worlde wicked doo proſper ſo god hath higher iudgement whiche hee reſerueth himſelfe therefore wee muſt reſtraine vnderſtanding thing wee ſee preſently thinke god doth worlde render euery man whiche prepared much brutiſhneſſe haue ſuch thought iob thē hath diſcuſſed cace alreadie meane hee ceaſſed dazeled whē came thinke vpon affliction hee ſo caried away asked vvhat haue woon giuing ſelfe ſo obeying god foraſmuch thē iob ſo diſmayd ſtarted aſide iuſtly vpbrayded vttering blaſphemie ſhall boot man haue walked god hereby wee warned bridle ſelues whē behold thing done world fall imagination ſay doth god diſſemble thus vvhy doth ſuffer church turmoyled ſo vvhy ſo great outrage done ſay let v bridle ſelues ſhort imagine theſe thing ſtraunge aſmuch blaſphemed god true lord imputeth blaſphemie vnto v howbeit goodneſſe neuertheles guiltie perſon iob holy ghoſt reproueth v ende ſhoulde miſlike ſuch blaſphemie abhorre ſoone cōmeth euill imagination thought ſhould put away knowing ſame woulde leade v greater blaſphemie god withhilde v furthermore let v marke behoueth v ſo much warer behalfe bycauſe ſee god ſeruants haue beene ſo toſſed tempeſt true ieremie aſketh wicked proſper god fauoreth ſeemeth proteſteth god rightuous iudgements rightful vſeth preface bridle lord ſayth know thou art rightuous yet eſcapeth vnſhaken vvee ſee abacuk ſayeth ſame reſpect abacuk doth like therin ſheweth reſtrayned feare reuerence god yet troubled mind dauid cōfeſſeth hapned much vnto ſee ſaid haue waſhed handes vaine giuing ſelf rightuouſneſſe indeuering ſerue god hath beene loſt time seeing dauid came poynt pray ſhall wee looke ſo true reproueth himſelfe therewithall confeſſeth foote vpon yee ſo readie fall afterwarde addeth lorde beaſt man worthie bee called reaſonable creature become vtterly brutiſhe like aſſe horſe therefore lorde thou muſt holde ſtrong hande elſe vndone seeing dauid confeſſeth hee exempted ſuche temptation pray ſhall ſaide afore cauſe alſo eſay vttereth ſaying ſay ye rewarde rightuous common ſaying ſingular one exhorteth faithfull cōclude fully reſolue themſelues reward rightuous ſay ſhall loſe labor ſeruing god ſeemeth bee common ſaying yet notwithſtanding prophete eſay maketh ſingular one reaſon bicauſe thing order worlde ſhal tymes therefore faythfull owne vnderſtanding vtterly diſmayed ſaying dooth god afflict v ſuch rigour vve bee readie murmur immediately yea wee ſhoulde fall blaſpheming god holdeth v backe declareth vnto v thing doth fauor vnbeleeuers although ſeeme haue forgotten v yet notwithſtanding muſt aſſure ſelues pitie v middes rigor wil aſſwage ſtripes yea ſhall diſcharged hande ſhould bee ouerwhelmed hundred thouſand time vtterly periſh hee preſerued v infinite goodneſſe thus muche concerning thys poynt wherein iob condemned ſaying ſhal boot man haue walked god throughly perſwaded ſo bicauſe amazed ſorowes conſidered god guiding ordinance ought true alwayes knew part yet condemned bicauſe hilde himſelfe ſo quiet peaſable ought haue done hundred thouſande time condemned learne owne iudges ende may acquit god ſayd concluſion god forbid euer ſhould iniquitie god vnrightuouſneſſe almightie haue note ſumme elius wordes may take profite whole diſcourſe ſhall ſee chapter behoueth v glorifie god rightuous ſumme whole chapter surely ſeemeth verie common neede ſpeake bycauſe ſee man dareth denie god rightuous yet notwithſtanding man ſhall hardly find one amongſt hundred acknowledgeth god rightuouſnes ought euen beſt fayle ſome poynt ſay euen rightuouſeſt ſhall bee tempted doubtes haue ſpoken of▪ vvhat ſhal become worldly brutiſh ſort acquainted magnifying god haue giuen minde therefore let v aſſure ſelues whoſoeuer ſhal haue borne away doctrine confeſsing god rightuous bee throughly perſwaded ſhall haue profited greatly day twaine hundred thouſande yeares hee liued ſo long worlde howbeeit behoueth v conſider ſort wee ſhoulde confeſſe god rightuous truely matter cannot nowe bee treated length yet muſt ſpeake worde open gap ſhall follow ſort wee confeſſe god bee rightuous onely ſingle counteruayleth reaſon v fully perſwaded thing god doth good rightfull although know reaſon doth man acknowledge god rightuous himſelfe able conceyue braine thing shoulde god ſubiect vnto v muſt fully conclude ourſelues god rightuous bycauſe rule rightuouſneſſe inſomuch whatſoeuer proceedeth behoueth v honour although finde ſtraunge imagination although ſeeme v ought bee ſo yet notwithſtanding let v bee reſtreyned ſuch reuerence confeſſe foraſmuch god fountaine rightuouſneſſe behoueth v think doings good thus ye ſee firſt place haue marke againe let v acknowledge rightfulneſſe thing come imagination ſuch wiſe wee may alwayes beare minde god rightuous vve ſee wicked raigne haue ful ſcope greeueth v ſeeming god ſleepe heauen hee remedieth thing firſt daſh thinke doth dutie yet neuertheleſſe behoueth v confeſſe god rightuous al theſe thing againe bee troubled afflicted one good another perſons ſee whole church generall trampled vnder foot ſubiect tyrannie wicked vvhat ſaid yet muſt ſtill acknowledge confeſſe god rightuous ſeeing ſo let v tarie till ſhewe v thing go ſo vntowardly ſeeming let v aſſure ſelues diſpoſing thing ſort without cauſe vvherefore let v ſhet eye thing go clean contrarie lyking let v ſettle ſelues vpon ſaid poynt ſay lord thou art rightuous content ſelf thy rightfulneſſe vntill thou make enter thy ſanctuarie perceyue thou ordereſt ſtate mankind ſort truely ſhoulde follow mine fancie ſhould murmure yea repine agaynſt thee ſee howe thing confounded heere foraſmuche wee knowe thou gouerneſt whole worlde thine infinite wiſedome iuſtice meete thou ſhouldeſt allowed ſhould confeſſe thy diſpoſing thing ſort rightfull although perceyue reaſon thus ye ſee ought practiſe leſſon effect let v fall face good god acknowledgemēt fault praying make v ſo feele may ſorie wee may hate wicked life paſt indeuer heereafter frame ſelues may receyue v mercie meane ſo gouerne v holy ſpirite may ſeeke altogither pleaſe frame life holy ſeruice ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly c cxxx sermon whch third vpon xxxiiij chapter 10 god forbid ſhould vnrightuouſneſſe god iniquitie almightie 11 ſhall render vnto man according vvorke cauſe euery man finde according vvayes 12 god vvill condemne nought neither vvill almightie ouerthrovv right 13 vvho hee hath viſited earth beſides vvho hee vvhom hath ſet ouer vvorlde vvho hath builded 14 turne heart tovvardes dravv avvay ſpirit breath 15 ſhall fleſh faile togither man ſhall returne duſt haue lay foorth ſentence ſeemeth bee meetely common namely vnrightuouſneſſe god euerie man confeſſeth fewe knowe fully perſwaded wee bee reſt god v wee deſire eaſie v conſent rightuous ſo ſoone wee bee troubled harme aduerſitie cumber v fall grudging acknowledge god rightuous wee done therefore ynough v proteſt one worde god rightuous cheefe poynt acknowledge doings bee good ſubmit oure ſelues willingly mightie power wee come practiſing ſo afflict v enter pleading diſcōtented gouerneth v otherwiſe deſire doth craue ye ſee wee ought conſider text ſhewed v vnrightuouſneſſe god ſhort vntill become ſo much reaſon bee quiet obedient vnto god thing hee doth although thing fall oure fancie purpoſe iudgement wee accuſe god vndirectly vnrightuouſneſſe hee gouerneth whole worlde nothing ſhall happen diſpoſition ordinance power finde fault thing happen bending ſelues agaynſt hath power let v learne ſubmit ſelues god prouidence confeſsing doyngs good ſhall count rightuous yeeld due prayſe wee replie agaynſt fret finde fault doings aſmuch wee blaſphemed calling vnrightuous true cannot otherwiſe affliction ſhall haue ſome heartburning yet muſt wee ſubdue paſsions holde priſoners conclude ſelues ſith god wholy good wiſe hee dooth thing otherwiſe reaſonably vprightly thus yee ſee howe wee ought fight agaynſt paſsions riſe v prouoke v aduaunce oure ſelues agaynſt god nowe let v ſee howe eliu proueth vnrightuouſneſſe god ſayth render vntoo men according woorkes make euerie man find according wayes ought wel noted knowe god rightuous himſelfe bee done rightuouſneſſe ſo ſhet vp ſhoulde knowne vnto v extendeth euery muſt knowne cheefly v vvill knowe god rightuous let v looke euerie v wee may well eſpie rightuouſneſſe conſidering world gouerned ſuch equitie fault founde ſurely euery man called right aray none ſhall haue occaſion complaine men muſt needes confeſſe bearing infinite goodneſſe puniſhing rightfull rigor lo wee haue gather vpon reaſon eliu alledgeth notable poynt haue ſayde afore whereas ſpeaketh v god rightuouſneſſe muſt imagine hee rightuous onely himſelfe conſider rightuouſneſſe becommeth v extende wee ought wit whole gouernment worlde wiſe god rightuous bycauſe guideth thing vprightly looke whatſoeuer ſee behoueth v allow rightfull bycauſe proceedeth meane ſinnes men commit meane god diſpoſeth thing ſuche wiſe ſouerain prouidence behoueth v think thing good proceede therefore v commeth examin himſelf let vnderſtande couert pleade againſt god neither god bee accuſed crueltie man ſay miſintreateth muſt neceſsitie allow rightfulneſſe gouerning guiding v furthermore wee comprehende matter throughly perſwaded euery v muſt firſt ſearch himſelfe conſider aduiſedly one cauſe wee ſo waywarde whatſoeuer god vnto v hee cannot content v wee alwayes ſo malapert lift vp ſelues agaynſt wee blinded vaine ſelfe ſoothings euery v thinketh himſelfe rightuous bycauſe thinke vpon ſinnes therefore haue skill knowe well owne faultes certaine replying agaynſt god ceaſe diſpatched ſo euerie v wil come humbly ſay lorde thou haſt handled mee ſuch ſort muſt needes acknowledge thy rightuouſneſſe glorifie thee vvee cannot beare beguile ſelues although wee haue thing replie yet wee alwayes leſſen fault yea couer though neuer ſo notorious foraſmuch wee bee ſo faſt aſleepe ſinnes hypocriſie eaſie v lift vp ſelues agaynſt god therefore men deſirous acknowledge god rightuous ende yeelde deſerued prayſe true remedie firſt make owne inditement accuſe condemne themſelues bee hard matter acknowledge god rightuous ſufficiently conuicted themſelues hath miſintreated done wrong chaſtiſing hath bin offence although hath vſed ſome rigour towards yet notwithſtanding hath alwayes borne thē goodneſſe mercie thus ye ſee effect wee haue beare minde therewithall let v marke ſayde god render vnto man according worke make euerie man finde according wayes ſo ment though god puniſhed breaker lawe hande mainteyned good ſhewe god dooth man wrong may well come paſſe happeneth dayly god beare wicked time ſeene hee maketh countenance men runne ryot euill ſeemeth thinke vpon ſee cauſe alſo harden wicked make bolder vnder colour god puniſheth hande ſeemeth quite ſcaped diſcharged god doth alwayes puniſh euill doings hand nother doth eliu meene doth ſo end god hath delayed long time prolonged term wicked length ſhew although wayted theyr repentance yet forgat miſdeedes regiſtred packed vp vpon great heape increaſe terror wrath delay therefore ſhall dearely ſolde vnto ſhall haue ſo abuſed god pacience forbare puniſh firſt ende ſhoulde haue leyſure know fault amend marke one point namely god executeth iudgement firſt day ſuch ſort may perceyue eye recompenceth euery man according workes good fayth thing ſhould puniſh ſinnes forthwith deſerue vve would looke day ſhould accompliſhed worlde article fayth concerning riſing comming iudgement ſeat lord ieſus chriſt ſhort ſhould neither reward good feare wicked rebellious alſo cauſe purpoſely ſayd holy ſcripture god render recompence requite saint paule ſpeaking rightuouſneſſe god ſayth recompence day day recompence laſt day elius ſaying agaynſt ſentence ſaith god render hee preſuppoſeth thing true namely behoueth v holde mindes ſtay vntill god ſhew v thing hidden v time faith ſay muſt exerciſed wayting paciently thing wee perceyue yet ynough v god giueth v ſome token iuſtice ſheweth v ſome notable example wherby inforced feele hath eye vnto men puniſh offence god giue v record let v contented meane pacient vntill know thing reſerueth himſelf thus ye ſee muſt take ſentence applie vſe ſecond poynt god doth ſo recōpence euery man according workes hee alſo beareth puniſheth ſheweth thē ſome fauour although one ſide rigorous make feele iudge howbeit v wit reſpect worlde god paſſeth puniſh ſinnes ſuch meaſure deſerue thing ſhoulde ſende v diſeaſes wantes ſuch thing hee ſhoulde thunder vpon v ouerwhelme v firſt blow ſo ſhould feele ſome terrible puniſhment hee ſhould arme himſelfe mightie maieſtie confounde ouerwhelme v ſinnes let v marke god puniſheth ſinners hande maketh feele vengeance full meaſure haue deſerued beareth ſo chaſtizementes wee receyue worlde god warning giuing leyſure repent ſame ſhall profit men▪ wicked condemned alreadie bycauſe bee paſt amendment god hath onely framed theyr inditement alſo ſet downe condemnation readie bee executed whenſoeuer hee howe ſoeuer worlde go wee conſider well chaſtizements god ſheweth v world nothing comparable vnto ſinnes giueth v reſpite ende ſhoulde thinke vpon thus ſee yet one poynt wee haue marke text thirde god dooth ſo recompence men according wayes hee reſerueth power himſelfe pardon thoſe liſteth intendeth bring backe himſelfe god doth puniſhe choſen pleaſeth receyue mercie bee one owne free goodneſſe ſo hee burieth ſinnes ſo hee entereth intoo iudgement ſayde pſalme god hath libertie put away offence without puniſhing yet ſame derogation iuſtice god liſteth forgiue ſinnes howe dealeth nouriſheth euill v toucheth v ſheweth v maketh v feele howe ſore haue offended afterwarde giueth v mind ſorie mourne ſinnes vvhen ſo touched repentance wee become iudges owne fault condemne meanes god hath executed office much manne condemneth himſelfe hee condemned god gnaſhed teeth aboade ſtill vnamendable ſtubborne wickedneſſe therefore god forgetteth office hee draweth v repentaunce hee pardoneth ſinnes intent cocker v contrarywiſe intente double rightuouſneſſe ſo one ſyde wee may feele euill wee haue committed ſide hee may make mercie ſhine vpon v diſcouer miſeries wherein wee till hee ſet v free therefore let v marke well god forgiuing offence choſen derogation al iuſtice ſaying ſhould alwayes true recompenceth men according workes maketh finde according wayes nowe wee ſee thing haue touched whiche glorifie god rightuouſneſſe behoueth v alwayes perſwaded affliction wee ſuffer thing wrongfully god hath reaſon chaſtice v wee enter intoo quarelling wyth wee ſhall make cace worſer furthermore let v vnderſtand god doth ſo beare v goodneſſe wee haue alwayes cauſe perceyue wee exceedingly bounde vnto hee vſeth extreeme rygour agaynſt v ought finally let v vnderſtande although make v feel vengeance yet ſpareth v although ſhewe himſelfe rough ſharpe yet doth hee intermeddle goodneſſe therefore hee alwayes rightuous inſomuche men ſhall gayne nothing thinke quit themſelues beſt v ſee god calleth v allureth v come vnto wee fall feeling offence blowes come ſorie mourne ſo god may bee inclined forgiue v lo haue effect remember ſentence according herevnto eliu greater confirmation ſayth god condemne nought ouerthrowe right ſpeaketh new thing ratifieth matter euen aunſwering vnto alledged iob firſt therefore ſayth god condemne nought ſay men neuer alledge hee doth wrong maketh beleeue haue done amiſſe haue according oftentimes poore innocent ſhall oppreſſed among earthly iudges charging thing nothing wherein faulty yet muſt fame paſſe way ſhalbe falſe witneſſes face though righteouſeſt man world man may oftentimes puniſhed wrongfully without cauſe ſo god iuſtice needeth ſhewe keepe great regiſters proofes excuce himſelfe ſlaundered men euery mā carieth owne indytement written well ſealed himſelf ſay neede none iudge owne conſcience though euery man knowe preſently yet god waken v well inough ſpight teeth wee ſhall haue flattered ſelues long time yet muſt returne point conuicted namely iuſte cauſe puniſh v cauſe alſo eliu addeth god ouerthrow right wee haue better ſhift flee ſtartinghole god almightie doth liſt wee cannot reſiſt dealeth croſly ouerthwartly v although wee ſpeake ſo yet haue wee ſuch crooked thought ſo vnder colour god almightie poore fraile creature would make beleeue tormenteth v ſore contrarywiſe ſayd god peruerteth right ſay neuer puniſheth men without continuall reſpect bearing according knoweth expedient cauſe ſpare ſurely would bicauſe knoweth meete let v practize well leſſon humbling ſelues god whenſoeuer chaſtizeth v let v keepe mouthes ſhut replie agaynſt withal let v meeke let hypocriſie blinde v ſooth ſelues miſdoings thus ye ſee effect howe behoueth v condemne ſelues therevpon acknowledge god righteous puniſhing v ouerthroweth right v ſo haue good cace mainteyne himſelfe wee ſhall neede neyther proctor aduocate himſelfe bee warrant deſireth nothing ſo much quit v wee condemned wee muſte paſſe way acknowledge haue well deſerued true well ſayde ingenerall behoueth euery one v particularly reſpect owne perſon haue leſſon well printed minde ſpecially wee bee beaten god ſcourges ſo one v pinched pouertie another ſicknes third ſome wrong done vnto ſide ſoeuer aduerſitie come vppon v let v acknowledge hande god viſiteth v good reaſon wee ſhoulde ſo wee bee wretched ſinners ranke rebelles againſt wee muſt go aboute qualifie faultes ſay god puniſhments vnmeaſurable though hee cauſe puniſhe v contrarywiſe thoughe hee ſhoulde execute muche greater rygour yea euen vtter ouerwhelming v yet let v confeſſe muche conſidering ſinnes come full meaſure yee ſee ſorte wee ought vnderſtande ſentence afterward addeth god hath ordeyned ſet ouer worlde beſides himſelfe albeit woorde eliu vſeth dothe ſometimes ſignifie viſite foraſmuchas ſenſe one neede ſtande muche vpon worde bee ſhort eliu ment ſay none god whiche gouerneth worlde hath fellow neither creator haue builded heauen earth hath hande guydeth gouerneth creature day ſo nothing done without yee ſee effect eliu ment ſay ſhould ſeeme reaſon fitte mainteyne righteouſneſſe god mightineſſe queſtion beſides haue touched alreadie ſomtimes vnder colour god almightie men would accuſe tyranny though regard infirmitie weakneſſe marke howe men take occaſion aduance themſelues agaynſt god confeſsing almightineſſe ſaying true ſouereine yet foloweth therfore hath good ſtay gouernment himſelfe ought haue albeit men vex torment ſeruants yet ſeemeth hee paſſeth hath regarde contrariwiſe eliu intendeth ſhew god righteous ſheweth onely ſayth gouerneth worlde ſeemeth nothing purpoſe well conſidered peremptory reaſon term ſufficient ynough ſtop mouth meeneth addeth immediately namely ſhall whiche vnrighteous gouerne true reſpect worlde wicked ſhall ſomtimes gouerne behold king borne woman come crowne heritage ſo likewiſe prince beſtow office vpon bawdes vpon men value well knowne maner one theſe courtier elſe ſell office ſo iuſtice goeth wracke thing handled gouernors ordeyned electiō voyce people feare god reuerence though ment ordeyne officer ſhuld raign iuſtice flocking tauerns cōmit ſhamefulleſt thing cā ſeeing king officer magiſtrates go election come degree ſo diueliſh meanes wicked muſt needes raigne ſo god bicauſe naturally hath ſouerein dominion whole world ſame due vnto choſen raſcals woulde faine haue confuſion raigne choſe ſuch ſhoulde ſupport euil nothing ouerthrow al good order common weale god choſen tauerne parcialitie briberie wicked practiſes hee called office fauor neither hath ſucceſsiō heritage though peeres agreed ſhould ſucceed mortall father none vvhat hee hath gouernment world nature inſomuch immortall god authoritie gouerning thing inſeparable ſayd xviij chap gen abraham abraham reaſoneth impoſsible god ſhould crueltie outrage iudge worlde ſayth abraham deſtroy good wicked abraham ſayth ſo meeneth counſell god bethink himſelfe one v might counſell mortall man moyſes ſpeaking iudges likewiſe ioſaphat ſay bethink ſelues ye ſit ſeate creature liuing god hath called throne whoſoeuer ſitteth muſt raigne man lieutenant god thē may wel admoniſh earthly iudges office may erre yea ſee men cōmonly ſwarue aſide vnto euil hold themſelues vnto good bycauſe wholy giuen vnto euill alſo bicauſe ſuch vertue ſtedfaſtneſſe moſt thē ought though good yet ſuch zealous indeuer requiſite thus ye ſee earthly iudges neede put mind dutie diſcharge themſelues ought abraham alledgeth vnto god iudge world cōdemne good wicked ſayeth ende namely ſhew god cannot transforme himſelfe ſhould alwayes rightuous well hee god nothing peculiar vnto god equitie wee accuſe god vnrightuouſneſſe aſmuch would make god idoll dead idle thing god gouerne world hath ſoueraine maieſtie ſuch wiſe himſelf muſt need iudge iudge muſt needes bee ſo vpright may nothing amiſſe according herevnto eliu ſayth nowe thing gouerneth muſt needes done rightly vnrightuouſneſſe bycauſe hath created world mainteyneth vnder protection guiding thus haue true vnderſtanding text remaineth gather doctrine fit inſtruction firſt let v mark well god hath created worlde leaue thing hauock fortune terme might gouerne hee intendeth mainteyning creature doth therfore call god maker heauen earth muſt reſtraine one inſtant muſt beare minde like god hath framed worlde ſo power ſtill hee diſpoſeth thing beneath ſo hath care v heares head numbred yea hee guideth footeſteps ſo nothing commeth paſſe foreappointed prouidence lo haue marke expreſly ſaid beſides none ſet ouer world none ſet ouer earth betoken creating world gouerning thing go ioyntly togither thē imagin god gouerneth thing ſome thing hapneth chance fortune followeth fortune goddeſſe hath created part world ſo prayſe due god alone beholde curſed blaſphemie ſhould thinke diuell could thing without god leaue one ſhould make diuel particreator world therfore let v lerne inſeparable bonde betweene theſe twoo thing namely god createth thing hee gouerneth thing cauſe expreſly ſayde god hath builded worlde wee thinke hee nowe calleth companion helpe order creature true god doth vſe inferiour meanes gouerne worlde howbeit diminiſh owne authoritie hee haue companion hee raigneth continually aboue vvhat elſe greateſt king god handes hee ſerueth turne thinketh good according prophete eſay vpbraydeth proude sennacherib thought himſelfe haue made thing owne cunning yea ſayeth god art thou elſe axe hande heweth man holde ſawe knife cut withall ſerue turne pleaſure toole turne ſelfe agaynſt man ſhew man hath onely handes armes helpe himſelfe withal alſo hath thing without cōmaundement power mortall creature liuing god holde nothing ſeparated haue life mouing therefore let v vnderſtande god vſeth worldly meanes ſerueth turne men inſtruments leſſen ſtrengthen owne authoritie contrariwiſe ſhew hath guiding commaunde whiſtle himſelf ſayth men muſt need go forward execute yea verie diuels hell compelled vnto although bee vnwilling vtterly agaynſt intent yet notwithſtanding god driueth violent power execute thing hath ordeyned prouidence ſo ſee ſort muſt conſider god prouidence namely hee hath care whole worlde watcheth ouer al creature foreſee may happen ſome fantaſticall perſons imagine god beholdeth thing aloof beneath prouideth afterward alſo much nothing may done hath determined ſo rule thing thus yee ſee ſhewed v text therefore behoueth v minde well prouidence god intent aduerſitie befalleth v wee may alwayes go firſt cauſe true diuerſe tymes men ſhall v v wrong ſee howe robbed iob goodes men may ſpoyle v goodes deceyte violence may oppreſſe v ſlaunders wicked reportes yea man may bee wrongfully ſlaine theſe thing behoueth v acknowledge god prouidence iob hath done ſet himſelfe againſt theeues robbed ſayth lorde hath giuen lorde hath taken away yet notwithſtanding satan bene worker iob knewe god made worlde dooth alwayes watch gouerne guide ſhewed heere therefore whenſoeuer afflicted although ſame come mē ſo v wrong outrage let v aſſure ſelues god holdeth • reynes bridle aboue haue v ſo afflicted behoueth v receiue ſame hand iudge may enter conſideration ſinnes yeeld ſelues guiltie hath bin ſayde long ſince thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne truely wee ſee wicked beare ſway heere beneath let v knowe part god iuſtice vvhereof commeth thing ſo troubled ſome men attaine office wicked bryberie parcialitie ſome purchaſe ende anon make hande againe poore people fleecing one deuouring another bycauſe god perceyuing v vnworthie bee gouerned giueth brydle satan ye ſee wrong raigne god ſcourges ſinnes wee haue ſeene heeretofore seeing ſo behoueth v conſider prince iudges earth wicked god intendeth giue greater gloſſe owne iuſtice may knowne vnto v howe hee afflicteth v meane puniſheth offence wee haue committed ſhewing wee deſerue haue come neere v rather withdrawe himſelfe v make v feele bycauſe wee diſordered haue ſhaken yoke become wilde beaſtes worthie haue diuell raigne ouer v wicked men vnderlings ſetting vp wee ſee god deſerueth bee glorified reſpectes whatſoeuer trouble perceyue worlde behoueth v alwayes come poynt ſeeing almightie impoſsible hee ſhoulde doo wrong hee worldly prince raigning men pleaſures ſet vp wicked practizes policy ſame nature hee god ſo alſo rightuous rightuouſneſſe cannot bee ſeparated mightineſſe haue ſayd afore nowe herewithall eliu addeth god turne heart vnto v take away ſpirite breath fleſhe ſhall fayle ſhalbe changed dust eliu matcheth god mightineſſe goodneſſe ſo hee ſheweth bee gouerned god hande wee muſt needes feele good mercifull towards v periſhe euerie minute houre needeth turne v duſt bring v vtterly nothing looke god ſayde god blowe vpon men immediately freſhneſſe chaungeth withereth fadeth away vvhen prophete eſay ſpeaking maner ſtrength men likeneth herbe floure ſayeth god breath vpon v hee ſereth v vp blaſting winde ſereth graſſe ſayde ſong moyſes true vſed another compariſon howbeeit tendeth ſame ende god withdrawe ſpirite breath periſh according alſo ſayde hundred fourth pſalme agreeth moreouer text haue alledged paules sermon ſeuenth chapter actes apoſtles namely haue life mouing god seing haue longer pleaſeth god ſhed ſpirite vpon v hee withdraw power muſt needes periſh hand vve ſee creature continue longer pleaſeth god mainteyne aſſoone hee withdraweth power returneth nothing concluſion thing wee haue touched ſtandeth faſt namely god mightie power heere ſo matched goodneſſe wee ought knowe neuer vttereth ſuch rigour agaynſt v therewithall alſo ſpareth v bycauſe ſhould periſh euery minute houre liſted withdrawe ſpirite v v conſider owne ſtrength haue wee meanes preſerue ſelues vvhat moueth god mainteyne v worthie inioy benefites beſtoweth vpon v nothing ſo againe pray bonde betwixt v furthermore oure ſtrength vvhat meanes haue none muſt conclude cauſe god ſhould preſerue worlde himſelfe good fountaine goodneſſe ſo moued outward reaſon beſtow great number benefites receyue dayly hande onely pleaſeth make v feele mercie gracious goodneſſe experience thus ye ſee onely life haue ſufficient recorde howe gracious mercifull god towardes v although handled roughly poſsible ſo pine away cumbred continuall trouble aduerſitie yet notwithſtanding wee bee conuicted onely breathing god maketh v feele goodneſſe liue withdraw ſpirite wee periſhe turne duſt yet life precious thing whatſoeuer come thus yee ſee men alwayes indetted vnto god howſoeuer hee deale true poynt deſerueth layde large howbeeit foraſmuch time ſuffer ſhall ſuffize euerie v beare minde thing haue touched wee looke neerely ſelues acknowledge wee bee nothing ſo eſteeming god mightie power hee ſheweth towards v ioyne goodneſſe therevpon bee moued confeſſe namely ſubmitting ſelues wholly vntoo beleeuing hee ſo gouerneth worlde doth thing weight meaſure iuſt vpright workes muſt confeſſe bee ſo although ſeeme ſtraunge fleſhly reaſon nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes▪ praying inure v conſidering knowing aright ſo may learne confeſſe alſo condemne life euery v particularly thing v ingenerall exhorted therewithall ſuffer ſelues guided hand paciently receyue aduerſities ſhall pleaſe ſende v end may ſettle ſelues much vpō tranſitorie life aſpyre vpwarde euerlaſting kingdome wherevnto hee calleth v ioy felicitie ſhall bee truely accompliſhed may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorāt ſoules miſerable bondage errour c cxxxj sermon fourth vpon xxxiiij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon 14 15 verſes vpon text added 16 thou haſt vnderſtanding heare vvhat ſay giue eare vnto vvordes 17 shall gouerne hateth iudgement ſhall vvicked condemne righteous 18 vvill man ſay king thou art vnfaythfull vnto prince vvicked 19 accepteth perſon great one neyther regardeth high lovve vvorke handes 20 ſhall die ſodenly midnight people ſhall takē avvay periſh mightie ſhall taken avvay euen vvithout hande haue tolde heretofore men heere put mind owne frailtie ende ſhould knowe god ſpareth wee abode one minute houre vpō earth ought thinke ſame gracious turne haue life breath v haue god ſo ſee maynteyneth v meere goodneſſe seeing ſo let v accuſe great rigour ſhould hee haue iuſt cauſe roote v vtterly vvho hee coulde ſo cleare himſelfe god ſhoulde haue cauſe puniſhe yet meane wee ſee god preſerueth world euery v kept ſtill aray ſo wee detters mercie farre hee vſing great rigour towardes v ought rather woonder pacience hee ſuffer ſuche iniquity thunder downe vengeance firſt brunt make cleare riddance v seeing ſo ought man murmure agaynſt wee thinke ſtraunge hee beareth men hee may well replie agaynſt v hee beareth v alſo therefore let v learne hereby glorifie god continually mercie leſſe power although hee almightie yet notwithſtanding hee reſtreyneth himſelfe bycauſe hee loueth v alſo haue one verie neceſſarie exhortation gather text whiche knowing oure owne frailtie wee ſhoulde learne put life hande god thinke liue continue ſtate owne power ſuffer god gouerne v pleaſeth bee alwayes readie depart hence hee thinketh good take v worlde furthermore meane liue well knowe inſomuch god poſſeſſeth v quickeneth v holy ſpirite good reaſon wee ſhoulde holde ende bee giuen wholy ſeruice liuing dying vvere doctrine wellprinted heart wee ſhould bee ſuche dullardes wee moſt part men riſe morning bethinke put themſelues hand god faſhion ſake touched quicke knowing life little blaſt winde may vaniſhe away turning hande acknowledge much behoueth v remember leſſon ſhewed v heere namely life ſhadowe vanitie therefore behoueth v put ſelues hande hee mainteyne v according good pleaſure alſo take v worlde time conuenient wee counſelled heere humble ſelues chalenge nothing ſelues owne power contrariwiſe wee haue whereon reſt oure ſelues wee knowe life euerie man hande onely hande god keeper scripture ſayth expreſly hee withdrawe ſpirit breath wee die long god preſerue v let v boldely defie diuell enimies true wee looke vpon rage men ſhall ſeeme rauening wolues wee ſillie ſheepe gape open throte ſwallowe v vp yet nothing v till god giue leaue without cauſe hee chalengeth reſerueth himſelfe power withdrawing breath hee hath giuen v therefore let v cōtented aſſuring ſelues god holdeth life cuſtodie protection vntill hee liſt take v worlde haue cauſed v finiſh courſe nowe man ſhoulde demaunde heere whether ſoules winde ſeeing ſayd wee ſhall periſh god withdraweth breath let v marke although men bee immortall yet notwithſtanding haue themſelues god free goodneſſe beſides elſe death departing ſoule bodie aſunder god withdraweth breath himſelfe hee ſendeth v duſt rottenneſſe yet neuertheleſſe fayleth take vp ſoules kepe till latter daye ſhort eliu ment ſhew weake tranſitorie alſo al ſtrength nothing furtherforth vphilde onely goodneſſe god hee vndoeth v outwarde appearance ſay effect hee doth thing determined hee thought good cauſe wee ought alwayes returne vnto content ſelues hath fatherly care v haue ſayde alreadie let v like theſe giddie heades truſt owne ſtrength thinke able worke wonder rather let v humilitie carefulneſſe hide ſelues vnder wing god praying guide v ſuch wiſe may liue according eliu hauing ſpoken ſo addeth exhortation ſaying thou haſt vnderſtanding hearken mee giue eare wordes ſheweth againe beginning true wiſedome yeelde ſelues teachable contrariwiſe ſo puffed vp ſelfeweening receyue doctrine ſo full owne ſeeming man tell suche vtterly paſt recouerie therefore without cauſe ſay firſt entrance foundation wiſedome ſuffer ſelues taught let v loke ſelues ſee whether owne reaſon ſufficient know diſcerne wee haue need nay contrarywiſe god telleth v wee brutiſh gay ſhewes men vanitie wiſedome vtter follie seeing ſo let v vnderſtande wee haue need taught men handes god ſay might ſupplie want therefore whoſoeuer deſire haue well grounded wiſdome let learne hearken doctrine profered name god let yeelde themſelues teachable lowly receiue wee forepoſſeſſed pride wee may well brag crake afore men yea haue great reputation wiſe men beholde god telleth v vanitie leaſing cauſe eliu ſayth purpoſely thou haſt vnderſtanding heare mee hee ſheweth man haue witte reaſon hee alwayes ſuffer himſelfe taught may fare better life contrarie part muſt marke man ſtande ſtubbornly thing hee hath conceyued giue men leaue tel mind heare thing hee foole rather ſtarke madde kinde verie madneſſe man ſhutteth dore agaynſt good doctrine weeneth himſelfe ſo wiſe hee hath neede taught refuſeth thing ſetteth barre hee woulde ſay god ſhall come nerer haue good leſſon marke text wee bee good vnderſtanding muſt ſheewe ſelues bee ſo receyuing quietly thing ſpoken tolde v contrariwiſe let v ſure god condemneth v fooles witleſſe perſons voyde reaſon bee ſo wilde headed giue eare thing men ſpeake v reiect good warning ſay wee better brute beaſtes ſhewe wiſedome ſoeuer bee v much know rude vnderſtanding thing able know know part ſo wee haue little taſte vnderſtanding come ſhort ala perfection ſtandeth v hande practiſe leſſon life long therefore conſideration thereof let v bee moued profite ſelues foraſmuch god ſo gratious ſpeake euery day vnto v continue doctrine meet ruling life let v alſo continually receyue brought vnto v name ſtill exerciſe ſelues ende wee may bee inſtructed wil behold ſay behoueth v practiſe doctrine therevppon eliu continue matter maketh compariſon betwene ſmalleſt greateſt ſaith vnto iob durſt thou ſay king thou art vnfaithfull vnto prince wicked th •• haddeſt ſouereigne lorde reigned ouer thee thou wouldeſt ſtand ſuche awe thou durſteſt miſſebehaue thy ſelfe towards let v ſee diueliſh furiouſneſſe men preſume murmure agaynſt god likeneſſe betwixt king may bee wicked maieſtie ſoeuer hee haue prince gouernors wicked ill diſcharge duty yet notwithſtanding mē beare reaſon ſtate behold god whiche accepteth man perſon breaketh theſe great one ſo honored world razeth thē wel little one ſhewing well maketh none account loftineſſe creature herevpon dareth open mouth agaynſt wee ſee elius intent howbeit better vnderſtāding text let v mark although prince gouerners bee ſuch ought bee yet neuertheleſſe god haue honored although themſelues vnworthie yet hath god imprinted marke haue men honor ſay wel lord theſe raigne thy name therfore behoueth v ſubiect vnto thē ſurely vaine triall ſuch authoritie rule like good father ſawe eies thei none care gouern v well matter obey thē vve would reſpect ſelues obeying god regarding owne profit contrarywiſe wicked frowarde perſons haue authoritie ouer v ſee notable fault wee neuertheleſſe mild hold ſelues vnder bridle yoke token reuerence god deſerueth seing ſo wee bee bounde ſake obey thoſe whome ſendeth whome ordeyneth ſuperiours although bee vnworthie cauſe ſayde lawe thou ſhalt rayle vppon ruler thy people god ſheweth well ſhall bee tyrant manaceth people puniſhment ſaying expreſly hee chaſtize ſending wicked gouernours whiche ſhall ſeeke nothing pill oppreſſe raigne outrage yet neuertheleſſe hee willeth men honour vvhy ſo although deſerue men ſhoulde acknowledge ſuperiors yet notwithſtanding god haue thoſe receyued ſake otherwiſe nothing worth ye ſee wee muſt ſubiect ſuch haue publicke power authoritie bycauſe knowe god humble v manner yea ſee child god haue bin faine ſubmit themſelues bondage vnbeleeuers god bring truely ſee alſo example daniell ſheweth v hee acknowledgeth raigning wicked reaſon ſinnes therefore muſt take ſcourge god cannot abide ſuch diſorder wee ſtriue againſt mortall men againſt heauenly iudge wee ſee effect wee bounde honour ſuch anie publike authoritie bycauſe bee aduaunced haphazarde god hathe ordeyned according written power proceedeth wee ſee anie diſorder wee muſt wyte vppon ſinnes therewithall forſomuch god hath ſtabliſhed ſayde order namely prince superiours ſhoulde bee obeyed ſhould ſubiect vnto muſt obſerued kept among v notwithſtanding whereas ſayde lawe thou ſhalt ſpeake euill prince thy people ment men ſhould allowe euill whereſoeuer bee ought dignitie man woorme earth ouerthrowe righteouſneſſe god ought ſentence rather haue courſe namely curſed call euill good whereas god hath forbidden priuate perſons rayle vppon ruler make v liue peace without trouble yeelde ſome reuerence ſeate iuſtice ſhoulde bee anie common weale among v wee ſhoulde become worſe wilde beaſtes yee ſee whervntoo god eye beſides wee knowe god ſent prophetes giue king prince power doo euill man ſhoulde ſhewe ſinnes rather ſayde thou ſhalte rebuke mountaynes ſay higheſt ſtates haue purpoſely ſet thee ouer realmes kingdomes ſayeth god prophetes ende glorie ſhould bee caſt downe ſhewe woorde cannot bee preached ought bee except preacher rebuke faultes ſuch defyle vnhallowe holie ſeate god abuſing ſwoorde put intoo hande bee euill wicked gouernours muſt bee ſharpely rebuked according deſeruings ſayde prophetes onely saint paule declareth wee alſo ought obſerue like preaching goſpell witte wee muſt pull downe loftineſſe lifteth vp ſelfe againſt lord ieſus chriſt thoſe needes bee ſpared haue vyces vntouched bycauſe bee ſome authoritie muſte goe coyne newe goſpell whiche number king oure dayes needes bee called annoynted holy yet cannot abyde haue ſores touched meanes woulde haue libertie peruert thing man bee ſo bolde open lippes againſt wee neede go ſo farre king prince euen thoſe manner nothing come anie ſmall degree thinke themſelues bee petigods needes bee honoured though bee laughed ſcorne worlde labour albeeit men ſee nothing theſe newe promoted raſcalles yet notwithſtanding treade good warning vnder foote vnder colour bee little aduaunced therefore muſte bee faine marke leſſon giuen contrarie part whiche foraſmuche ſoftineſſe theyrs aduaunceth ſelfe agaynſte god bycauſe ſtoupeth great king lorde ieſus chriſt v cace vſe freedome god hath giuen v thus yee ſee meane obſerue doctrine rayling ſpeaking euill king prince wee muſte muche v reuerence ſeate iuſtice bycauſe ſerueth procure peace welfare men auoyde trouble ſeditions yet notwithſtanding ſuche doo amiſſe muſt bee rebuked highe ſtate dignitie god aduauncing intent ſhoulde doo euill confounde honeſtie rather holde brydle reſtreyne thing confuſion nowe wee muſte god ſake reſpect yeeld ſuche reuerence thoſe equall ſtate v ſauing god hath ſet ſeate preferment bee ſubiect ſhall wee doo wee come ſoueraine maieſtie men degree authoritie ſoeuer bee whether bee king prince gouernours fayle bee wicked except god holde backe holy ſpirite cace ſtandeth otherwyſe god hee hath euermore ſoueraine dominion ouer worlde hee ordeyned wicked practyſes hee ſet heauen alehouſe knightes wote outlawes yet fauour brybing folke neyther choſen wicked men voyces might ſay hee beare v oute wee ſhall haue libertie doo wee liſt god came kingdome ſuche meanes neyther hee come heritage ſucceſsion manner men chaunce inaſmuche hee euerlaſting god therefore hee alſo bothe king iudge worlde seeing hee ſo dareth nowe open mouthe checke agaynſt vvee feare king well done hee bee feared alſo wee ſtande awe oure gouernours good reaſon wee ſhoulde doo ſo ſeeing god hath honoured whole worlde compariſon holdeth thing hys hande hee needeth lay open hande holde worlde althoughe hee ſhette yet ſayde prophete eſay hee holde king gouernours whole multitude men one little graine duſt ſeeing ſo dare wee lift vppe oure ſelues agaynſte vvhat boldeneſſe therefore needeth none euidence condemne ſuche chafe ſette themſelues agaynſt god reuerence whiche beare men suche ſpewe oute iniuries ſort god handleth owne lyking murmure ſaying cannot tell god meeneth meete hee ſhoulde plague mee manner vvhy ſuffereth hee wicked doo worſt good bee turmoyled yet meane hee remedyeth ſaye man ſhoulde aske theſe fellowes make ſuche diſputations bolde caſt foorth ſuche blaſphemies whether durſt go haue ſwoorde theyr hande rayle vppon ſpitte face ſay wicked dare would ſaye thou art afrayde mortall man bycauſe god hathe giuen ſome little ſparke glorie commeſt thou aduaunce thy ſelfe agaynſte hathe made faſhioned thee vvilte thou make accounte power whome whole world nothing vvilte thou checke agaynſte like madde man thinke gette vpper hande vvhen thou ouerſhooteſt thy ſelfe ſort ſhall bee thy confuſion thus yee ſee ſort behoueth v ſende thoſe lift vp themſelues agaynſt god vntoo ſimilitude ſet downe heere likewiſe euerie one v muſt owne accorde come wee bee tempted impaciencie ſurely theſe temptation happen vntoo euerie man ſo wee bee prouoked pleade agaynſte oure lorde often hee doth wee woulde haue therefore wee moued vntoo let v thinke thus thou durſteſt ſpeake agaynſt king againſt prince thy ſoueraine rule ouer thee feare brideleth thee bycauſe god hath imprinted ſome marke maieſtie dareſt thou lift vp thy becke againſt thou wretched creature art thou ſayde daniell god ſheweth well prouidence king prince obeyed wee knowe nothing contrarie man nature bee ſubiection god gaue authoritie ſuche ſet publike ſtate men woulde neuer obey cauſe expreſſely ſayde god putteth feare birdes ayre intoo beaſtes earth ſo men become vtterly brutiſhe yet muſte needes keepe ſtill vnderſtanding ſuche aduaunced ſeate iuſtice ought bee obeyed yet notwithſtanding verie ſmall portion god glorie shall wee goe make open warre agaynſte maieſtie next way breake neck wee leape three ſteppes downe ynough brooze v wee leape oute windowe two ſtrydes high grounde beholde wee deade would leape aboue heauen fetch gambaldes kicke againſt god ſhall wee bring wee ought well conſider infinite glorie god humble ſelues vnder thing expreſly ſayd accept perſon great without regarding eyther rich poore layeth hande vpon men rooteth one night euen ſtrongeſt ſhalbe taken away hande vvhen wee heare let v vnderſtande firſt ſuche greate muſte truſte rich credit knowledge thing elſe true worldwarde ſhall honored ſeeme able mainteyne themſelues bycauſe bee rich haue well wherewith alſo bycauſe fauor theſe thing nothing god therfore let man bee proude owne greatneſſe ſuche ſtand gazing like peacock owne tayles run headlong owne confuſion inaſmuch flatter themſelues become alwayes bolder euill kindling god wrath agaynſt yee ſee great men ought put doctrine vre knowing god accepteth mennes perſons meanes thereof ought alſo looke trample little one vnder theyr feete ſuche vnder theyr power marke heere ende doctrine applied purpoſe tolde v god accepter perſons ende hee hath ſeruantes ſhoulde oppreſſe vſe vprightly saint paule declareth hee publike authoritie ſhoulde haue ſuch regarde gouerning ſubiects know brother bycauſe v child god hath done v ſo much honour make v membres ſonne lord ieſus chriſt let great men world learne abſteine ſwallowing vp little vſing outrage towards let v learne abſteyn aduauncing ſelues proudly agaynſt thoſe inferiours accepting perſons god men truſt ſo ſhadow rich credite let v aſſure ſelues god iudge without regarde bee nowe yea damnation readie prepared ſo ſhall bee forced feele part ſhape worlde whiche vaniſheth hande saint paule ſayeth heerewithall let v marke well howe ſayd great ſmall ſhall bee taken away turning hande god make bee wyped away midnight time folke giue themſelues reſt euery man ſeemeth eaſe yea ſtrongeſt ſhall bee taken away without hande ſay without preparation god ſhall neede arme manie ſouldiours prepare himſelfe greatly ouerthrowe greateſt ſtrongeſt hee needeth blowe vppon elſe turne away hys heart ende drawe ſpirite ſhall periſhe hath beene declared heertofore hereby wee may bee taught euerie man owne ſtate let great one knowe god aduauncing ende ſhoulde diſpyſe others vaunt themſelues oppreſsing leſſer ſort rather let knowe ſo muche bounde vnto god haue theyr owne ſeeing thing bee giuen ought therefore acknowledge whence come aboue thing let remember iames ſayeth let brother ſayth exalted worldwarde glorie lowlineſſe rich ſuch honoured men skill credite glorie highneſſe forget themſelues ſo vnthankful god throw themſelues hedlong intoo deſtruction therfore behoueth looke neerly vnto themſelues know haue nothing meere goodneſſe god foraſmuch hold behoueth dedicate themſelues wholy vnto take occaſion miſintreat inferior rather ſtoupe applying themſelues brethren ſlenderneſſe paule exhorteth v touching mean one true may well glorie greatneſſe ſeeing god hath adopted child yet muſt therefore winke owne ſtate ſpecially whereas nothing worldewarde vtterly deſpiſed let acknowledge leſſe nothing god ſauing pleaſeth preſerue grace ye ſee wee haue one common leſſon taught vntoo v therefore let euerie v calling learne referre himſelfe vnto god holde life appurtenance thereof furthermore whereas ſayde god wipe away ſtrongest without hande ende wee ſhoulde learne put difference betwixt god men greateſt prince intende bee auenged enimies haue neede arme men warre ſeeke meanes bring enterpriſe aboute god woulde ouerthrowe deſtroy whole world hee ſhoulde finde let hee ſhall neede craue ayde others wage men buſie himſelfe caſting ordinaunce furniſhe himſelfe artillerie hee needeth none theſe thing hee without man hande withoute worldely helpe without ſtrayning himſelfe ſay hee deſtroy hee needeth breathe vpon v looke ſternely vpon v beholde wee ouerwhelmed vndoubtedly ſeeing hys looke maketh mountaynes rockes melt ſhall hee neede thunder vpon v deſtroy v shall wee able abide god looke caſteth vpon v shall bee able abide breath bloweth agaynſt v muſt wee needes vtterly quaile furthermore purpoſely expreſſed ridde v vaine fancy preſumptions haue wee bee well furniſhed worldwarde although men dare ſay ſufficiently armed withſtande god warde ſtrokes hande yet doo thinke ſo proofe thereof yee threaten riche man prouertie hee looke ſcorne ſay tuſh haue haue hee ſpight god open mouth howſoeuer game go truſteth ſtill rich ye ſhall gaine ſo muche hande perſwade goodes ſhall warrant man ſtrong luſt flower age thinketh euer ſhal grow olde neither honor skill ſhame meeneth lo howe men preſume themſelues ſeene cheefly great men worlde ſtand ſo ſtoutly againſt god cannot tamed thē men haue fauor credit beare themſelues hand haue bulwark againſt god make rampire worldly helpes onely ſo alſo man come tell faultes god correction haue place enterance vnto wil ſo much heare ſhort men neuer made humble force bycauſe vaine truſtes wherein ſotte themſelues thinke well garded haue meanes ynough defend therfore purpoſely ſayde god deſtroy ſtrong without hand ende wee ſhoulde thinke ſcape thoughe wee haue furniſhed ſelues prouided long aforehande oure matter ſo ſeemeth vntoo v god cannot come neere v let v ymagine theſe vaine fancy god tell well ynough intrap v ſome meane wee cannot conceiue deſtruction ſhall come without hande withoute inferiour meane lo wee ought minde theſe ſentences ſtandeth vppon fearing god wrathe therewithall contrarie ſide wee haue comfort ſayd god ſaue people withoute bowe withoute ſpeare withoute ſwoorde withoute hande man therefore like wee bee taught humble ſelues knowe meanes worlde ſhall auayle v god enimie euerie v taught ridde himſelfe vaine pride wherewith wee bee puffed vppe nature finally wee bee exhorted modeſtie ende wee ſhoulde preſent ſelues afore god conſider hee turned away v hee could euery minute houre chaunge v bring v nothing pull downe higheſt v ſo contrarie part bee miſintreated oppreſſed heere beneath ſee great alteration ſo tyrant become like woolues deuoure ſheepe flocke god let v reſort warrant god hauing promiſed ſaue church without man helpe put ſame vre euen vnto ende although wee bee deſtitute worldly helpes ſo wee ſeeme left vp ſpoyle enimies furniſhed thing may ſerue deſtroy v hundred thouſande time yet let v truſt mightiepower god whiche inuiſible worlde vvee perceyue howe god maintaine v vndoubtedly ſtraunge thing howe mainteyneth v daye ende wee ſhould alwayes confirmed doctrine wee ſhall bee ſaued without hande man ſay god vtter ſuche force yet hidden v wee conceyue ſhall pleaſe plucke v vvoolues throate mainteyne v nowe god muſt worke ſuch faſhion preſerue v temporall life pray ſhall hee ſaluation farre higher preciouſer thing vvill god ayde himſelfe man hande commeth drawing v hell deliuering v tyrannie diuell ſinne aduaunce v heauenly kingdome defende v agaynſt ſo many temptation let v aſſure ſelues hee doth owne power owne meere goodneſſe ye ſee one ſide behoucth v learne feare humilitie bee puſſed vp vaine preſumption deſpiſe god rather tremble vnder conſidering haue thing reſiſt remedie preſent ſelues praying beholde v mercie afterwarde ſo diſmayed beaten downe let v come ſecond point good chere bicauſe god hath promiſed ſaue v yea euen without hand man although perceyue done reſpect world let v therefore doubt hee performe ſaluation inaſmuch needeth helpe letted accompliſh promiſe ſo performe ſhall perceyue truſting hath bene vaine nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying ſo opē eye may ſeduced hypocriſie preſume aduaunce ſelues rebelliouſly againſt may pacient euē aduerſities ſhall ſend v learne humble ſelues vnder maieſtie glorifie thing well ware reſiſt wiſe neither hand tong redie frame ourſelues peaſeably good wil knowing alwayes iuſt vpright wee may ſo liue whyle ſhall pleaſe keepe v world wee may conſider life dependeth vpon otherwiſe ſhould fayle euery minute houre therwithall learne yeeld thanks pleaſeth continue goodneſſe towards v whereof wee ſo vnworthie may pleaſe graunt grace c cxxxij sermon fift vpon xxxiiij chapter 21 eye god vppon euerie man wayes ſeeth ſteppes man 22 darkeneſſe dimneſſe ſo thick woorke iniquity maye hyde themſelues 23 god layeth vpon man ſo walke god iudgement 24 breaketh mightie without inquiſition ſetteth others place 25 bringeth workes light turneth night breake 26 ſmiteth wicked place seer ſaw yeſterday god liſt puniſh men needeth make great preparation arme men borrowe ſtrength elſewhere hee coulde deſtroy thing onely looke therefore hee needeth ſerue himſelfe man hande neceſsitie true ſometimes hee doth ſo ſhew howe thing ſubiect creature yeldeth itſelfe ſeruice yea euē execute puniſhmēts mindeth haue done yet needeth prepare himſelf long afore hād puniſhing v hereby wee put minde humble ſelues vnder mightie hande aſſuring ſelues way world fence ſelues agaynſt v ſhall execute whatſoeuer hee hath determined owne purpoſe ſo men may well exalt themſelues pride ende ſhall feele power reſiſt god folowing ſame matter wee haue touched alreadie eliu addeth god dooth theſe thing abſolute lawleſſe power bycauſe bee knoweth men wayes marketh ſteps thē theſe great chaſticements happē ſo mightie people ouerthrowne battel realme conquered let v aſſure ſelues god vttereth ſuch power without cauſe hee doeth iuſtice though wee perceiue reaſon god vſeth ſuch rygour let v referre knowledge whole vnto whome belongeth let v content ſelues knowledge whiche ſhewed v heere namely wayes men knowne vnto howe happeneth oftentymes enter diſputation god iudgements thinke ſtraunge bycauſe ſee ſo cleerely doth howbeeit foraſmuch office iudge men wayes let v agree although ſee doth yet let v aſſure ſelues cace alwayes fall good rightfull ſeeing ought chaſtice onely particular perſons alſo whole nation countreys ſaying god marketh men pace taken two wayes scripture ſometymes referred god promiſes bycauſe carefull gouerne v text alſo manie others ſayde god beholdeth ſteppes bycauſe nothing vnknowne oure whole lyfe muſt come account therefore let v walke eye ſhall bee vaine v hide ſelues according alſo eliu addeth neither darkeneſſe miſt ſo thicke wicked bide themſelues without cauſe thys added wee ſee althoughe euery man confeſſe god beholdeth workes muſt needes bee oure iudge yet notwithſtanding men doo bleare owne eye conſider god perceyueth ſurely naught ſayde pſalme wicked beare themſelues hande god ſeeth craftineſſe malice alſo vpbrayded prophet eſay dig themſelues caues vnder earth hide themſelues god seeing hypocriſie doth blind men ſo ſore needefull marke ſentence darkeneſſe ſo thicke hide wicked god ſight better conceyuing heereof behoueth v firſt remember haue touched namely men although bee ſure ſhall one daye come iudgement ſeate god doo neuerthe leſſe ſeeke ſtartingholes therevpon ouerſleepe themſelues lurking hole though coulde beguile god see hypocriſie heerewithall let v marke men deceyue themſelues ſhrinking away ſort god bycauſe themſelues haue loſt remembrance thinke hee alſo hath turned backe remembreth miſdeedes let v beguile ſelues ſuch imagination although diſcountenance thing time yet ende hee ſhewe hee forgat office iudge whole worlde onely bring euerie man work light alſo euen deepeſt thoughtes according propertie ſearch men heart vaine chalengeth title therfore mark two point wee haue conſider text one muſt bethinke v vice ſo deeply rooted v wit thinke ſcape god hand ſtartingholes drunken ſinnes ſo alſo thinke wee god hath eye ſhet blindfolded elſe hee hath curtaine drawne afore ſo hee cannot perceyue thing wee hide howbeeit ſide ſeconde poynt let v marke howe ſayde darkeneſſe ſhall bee diſcouered bee liſteth therevpon let v take warning thinke ſelues haue made better market mē priuie naughtineſſe cauſe ſendeth many deſtruction go good men leaſtwiſe ſtop mouthes ſuch priuie wickedneſſe thē triumph dare ſpight god himſelf let v aſſure ſelues ſhal haue gayned nothing deceiuing world goodly ſhewes ſoeuer haue made ende wee muſt come heauenly iudge open bookes faſt ſhet cauſe great day appeare intent bring darkeneſſe light nowe keepe thing huckermucker cauſe holy scripture ſpeaketh ſo often one place one tyme onely ſayd darkneſſe god cauſe ſentence ſo often repeated bycauſe wee cannot bee perſuaded wee haue eſchued ſhame world wee beare oure ſelues hand god ought ſtirre filthineſſe diſcouer let v aſſure ſelues hee make knowledge come euen vnto heauen seing wee cannot bee perſuaded ſuperfluous thing holy▪ ghoſt doth ſo often tell v god iudge another faſhiō mortall men doo adayes cauſe purpoſely ſayd heere ſinners ſhall hyde themſelues eliu ſhoulde ſaye commeth dayly paſſe men eye ſo dazeled take vice vertues yea ſo euill minded dooth good bee flattered according ſee euill hath full ſcope condemning vice euery man vpholdeth may come paſſe ſeene experience vice ſhall reigne ſhall bee ſuch floud iniquitie thing ſhall bee turmoyled among men ſhall bee iudgement diſcretion yet muſt goe farre otherwyſe god vvherefore let v learne lift vppe eye aboue worlde fayth beholde god iudgement nowe hidden knowing thing muſt bee diſcouered according ſaide daniell bookes ſhall bee layde open ſay recordes ſhall layde v vvhat maner recordes paper parchment owne conſciences ſo euery man ſhall bring araignment written ingrauen ſo deepely ſhall bee diſguiſing beſides god himſelfe ſhall bee perſon ſonne ſuch light thinges ſhall bee knowne yea euen whiche nowe vnder deepe dungeon theſe thing muſt bee ſeene angelles heauen creature let v bethinke v ende wee may walke maner feare haue done ridde ſelues hypocriſie wee cannot amende market flattering ſelues ſayde afore finally let v learne make oure reckening withoute oure hoſte often cace concerneth examining oure life let euery v cyte himſelfe god preſence therewithall conſider ſayde heere ſeeing office ſerche men heartes yea euen theyr deepeſt thoughtes purpoſe quitte oure ſelues nowe men bycauſe wee cannot thereby eſcape hande therefore let v learne examine oure ſelues ſort furthermore ſuffer darkeneſſe bee lightned god woorde ſeeing poynte alſo attributed vntoo ſayde ſentence neyther darkeneſſe death 〈…〉 ye mist ſo thicke byde thoſe woorke wickedneſſe therefore apoſtle epiſtle hebrewes witneſſeth like god knoweth mennes heartes ſo hee haue worde bee two edged ſworde cut aſunder thought affection yea enter euen vntoo maree diſcouer thing hidden v sainct paules meening god worde preached wee muſt needes bee reproued though article written agaynſt v whole life layde afore v wee maye bee conuicted vtterly caſt downe ende glorifie god acknowledging howe greatly bee guiltie therefore let v onelye cyte ſelues god iudgement ſeate intent correct feynedneſſe alſo oft worde rubbeth ſores rebuketh oure vyces let v take paciently preſume bee willfull ſhall wee winne vve ſee many men adayes chafe frette vice bee touched woulde folke ſhoulde beare ſtill one woulde god ſhould haue anie authoritie ouer bee theyr iudge conſidered well ſayd would bee ſo dull ſeene bee bee alwayes newe learne thing manne ſhew anye thing commonlye knowne ſcornefull may bycauſe neuer felt auayleableneſſe doctrine darkneſſe god ſight defyle themſelues hanging groyne downe grounddwarde lyke ſwyne ſleeping ſuch ſorte ſhoulde ſeeme vntoo ſinnes nothing notwithſtanding number ſo great may ſeeme bee ſaped yet filthineſſe ſtinketh vnto bycauſe themſelues rotten therefore would behoue thinke little vpon leſſon would quiet whē men ſhew vice wonder ſee although many mēs wickedneſſe apparāt world inſomuche euen little child iudge yet notwithſtanding aduaunce themſelues agaynſte god deſpiſe abyde rebuked ſhame ſpeake thing vnknown neither ſtande wee vppon examination men thoughtes ſeeking vnder earth thing vnknowne men worlde ſeeth miſcheefe doth ſo ouerflow pitifull ayre ſtinkes yet notwithſtanding theſe good catholikes would bee taken good chriſtians haue alwayes goſpell mouth yea bite like maſtie dog mad woulde men ſhoulde ſtill diſſemble thinke men great wrong diſcouer lewdneſſe ſay truth diſcouered v onely ſpoken bycauſe men knowe yet neuertheleſſe haue ſayd cannot nowadayes abyde god ſhould lay open lewdneſſe ende might bee aſhamed repent ſhall feele end muſt faine come iudgement ſeate ſhall bee darkneſſe miſt hide let v vnderſtande greatly oure profite god doth nowadayes ſende v worde inlighten v may well bethink v ſinnes inſomuch although wee haue knowne time yet maye come remembrance wee put thing vre whiche haue alledged oute saint paule caſt ſelues downe aſhamed god condemne oure ſelues feeling naughtineſſe rooted deepe v beholde ſay god worketh ſaluation making v feele ſuch power affectualneſſe worde indeuer examin whole life throughly ende miſlike thoſe ſtubborne deſpiſe god come like ſtraught men iuſtle agaynſt cannot abide warning hee muſt ſend vnreaſonable folke daye whereof eliu ſpeaketh heere wherein ſhall darkeneſſe couert ſo cloſe ſhall layde wyde open yea euen creature cannot nowe indure god ſhoulde make aſhamed ende burie ſinnes euer howbeeit ſpight teeth angel men deuilles muſt knowe wickedneſſe muſt bee aſhamed euery power light ſhall diſcouer ſecrets thus yee ſee howe wee ought applie text inſtruction ſurely lordes threatniug men great daye ende ſhoulde preuent ſo remedie readie v haue earſt ſayd god delayeth inditing v till wee appeare altogither executeth iuriſdiction dayly goſpell according alſo lorde ieſus chriſt ſayth holy ghoſt came ſhould iudge worlde therefore goſpell preached doth god execute ſoueraine iuriſdiction properly vppon men body bee day vpon ſoules hee haue v condemned welfare therefore haue touched alredie ſeing god doth ſo much ſo often warne v wee muſt ende come great light let v ſtil ſhet eye wilfully wittingly blinded ſendeth v word diſcouer filthineſſe ſhew v cannot hide ſelues ſight ſo let v profit ſelues meane giuen v daye wee play wilde beaſts ſeeke lurking hole ſtill yet ende ſhall feele whether ſayd vaine darkneſſe god make v beholde thoſe thing countenance glorious maieſtie wee woulde ſee heere mirrour worde eliu addeth immediately lay vpon men ſhould come iudgement text dyuerſly expounded ſome take though god would lay burthen vppon man hee ought man coulde beare whole proces text well conſidered wee ſhall finde foraſmuche treatiſe concerneth god iudgements eliu vpholdeth god afflicteth v ſuch ſort may haue occaſion pleade agaynſt behoueth v alwayes conſider matter hee dealeth withal man knowe ment ſentence let conſider himſelf cace concerneth ſuch thing groūd treated therevnto muſt whole ſequele bee referred thing bee conſidered generall grounde text men may peraduenture grudge agaynſt god ende ſhall confounded although god ſeeme nowe handle v great rigour yet thing throughly well knowne mouthes ſhall bee ſtopped god ſhall bee glorified ſayde one fiftie pſalme let v marke well howe ſhewed v heere fayre pleading agaynſt god cace ſhall quayle ende bee founde god hath handled v vnindifferently layde ſore burthen vppon v ſay hee hath afflicted v meaſure although hee doo nowe ſtrike men able beare yet reaſon haue deſerued heereby put minde pryde rather rage v driueth v murmure agaynſt god howe doo wee pleade ſhoulde ſeeme v ſome iudge vmper whome hee ſhould bee iudged god make accounte ſhould bolder ſpight hee handleth v owne liking thinges come paſſe wee would haue let v learne men condemned diueliſh pryde prouoketh pleade againſt god howbeit behoueth v conſider well god abace himſelfe ſo farre anſwere v wee ſummon lawe hee cace appeare oure counterpartie true haue declared afore hee doubtleſſe come thither ende euen ſhewe thing tolde v heere wit although power cyte god make anſwere ſo hee bounde cleere ſelfe doings might haue tung wil ſpeake againſt yet would ſtand v ſtead end come vpſhot founde god hath charged v ſore aboue reaſon bycauſe ſinnes knowne vnto ſo known tell meaſure chaſtizement wee deſerue welſpring whence pryde commeth would owne iudges iuſtifie ſelues hath giuen v ſo great authority behold iudgement giuen vnto lorde ieſus chriſt therfore behoueth v come al lowlyneſſe reuerence heare receiue ſo euer pronounceth vpon v without gayneſaying euerie v beleued cace therfore graunt ſo much god mortall men worldly iuſtice ſet iudgement ſeate muſte bee iudge partie yet notwithſtanding hee oftentimes iudge wrongfully men corruptible yet men chaunge behalfe touching outwarde order god hath ſet ſhall wee doe wee come glorious maieſtie wee ſee alſo cauſe whence miſcheefe proceedeth ſame haue touched namely wee eſteeme workes owne fancie neuertheleſſe yee ſee heere god reſerueth iudgement ſelfe belongeth ſayth hee conſider ſteppes doe marke ſearch euen bottome meddle matter ſo euer thruſteth himſelfe play iudge taketh vpon dewe done lorde afflicteth v let v referre oure matter vnto aſſuring ſelues ſpieth many vice v hiddē oure ſelues behold lorde true perceyue hundreth part faultes euen bycauſe blynde bycauſe ſhaped euill bycauſe deuill hath bewitched lord could firſt perceyue better iniquity haue committed thee yeeld ſelf giltie neuertheleſſe muche competente iudge conſider myne owne fault yet thou haſt done honour become iuſt iudge thy ſelfe put cace thy hande aſſuring ſelfe thou ſeeſt thing vnknowne lo expreſly ſayd texte although went law god yet ſhould bee founde daunger lette v preſume pleade howe fayre ſhewes coloures ſo euer haue men ſhall confounded take hand come god thus yee ſee effecte eliu ment ſay verſe heerevnto addeth god breake mightie yea euen without inquiſition put others place bring workes light turne night darke ende breake vvhereas ſayth god breake mightie without inquiſition ende make v feel better authoritie deſpize ſo boldly bycauſe dull true ſome ſteade word inquiſition doe tranſlate number ſayde althoughe mightie infinite number yet notwithſtanding god would fayle breake worde worde thus hee breake ſtrengthes multitude men word importeth either afterwarde followeth ſhall inquiſition muche worde inquiſition ſignifieth properly ſearch make inquirie doubt eliu ment ſay god needeth make inquiſitions earthly iudges muche creature ignorance therfore fayne helpe ſelues ſuch meanes propheſie thing muche thing open god iudge men withoute ſuch kynd proceding ſee common weales world yet eliu ment betoken god alwayes make v priuie executeth iudgementes ſhall blynde behalfe inquiſition whereof ſpeaketh properly referred vntoo god chaſtizing men ſayde iudges make proces ſhall bee commoned forme ſtyle ſhall obſerued ſo men ſhall knowe thinges afterward ſentence ſhall bee publiſhed men may knowe crymes offendour ſorte conuicted muſt meaſure god mightie power authoritie theſe law men hee breake without inquiſition ſay without ſhewing v always publiſh ſentence men offence ſhall alwayes rehearſed neyſhal vttered puniſhed ſhall hiddē v yet meane ceaſſe put iudgements ſtill execution nowe wee ſee naturall ſenſe texte yet notwithſtanding hee addeth thing done vniuſtly god ſayth wil bring workes light although god puniſhe without inquiſition ſay without ſuche forme proceeding requiſite worldly pollicie yet doth thing reaſon vprightneſſe bee perceiued firſt day let v tarie till thing diſcouered till bring thing light whiche nowe wrapped vp confounded together heere wee haue take warning wee flatter ſelues haue bene wont behold cauſe wee doe continually followe owne ſway god ſeemeth ſpare v thinke wee haue libertie doe euill bycauſe vnpuniſhed bycauſe god beginneth chaſtice v common maner perceyue forepoſſeſſed blockiſh fleſhely careleſneſſe afterwarde commeth great roughneſſe ſo diſmayd know thunder vpon ſuddeine vvhich thing doth thinketh good hee hath borne long time hee needeth lift vp hand men periſh twinckling eye hath bene ſayd afore therefore end euerie v may ſtirre vp ſelf earely late let v remember texte god make long proces puniſhing v bound law let v conſider ſay muſt alwayes readineſſe delay til ſmite v rather aduiſedly preuent iudgement according ſayd man happie hath carefull heart furthermore let v alſo remember horrible threatning wicked ſhall ſay peace goeth well v ſhall deſtruction fall vpon head let faythfull vnderſtande god liſteth puniſhe hee needeth beginne one poynt afterwarde delay ere goe forwarde worke mortall men reaſon let haue hee condemne execute ſentence needeth trouble himſelf making long proces v wee ſhall haue leyſure breathe vpon matter neither ſhall pine diſtreſſe till wee may bee quite diſpatched hand ſhall bee confounded quickly heauen fell downe vpon heades ouerwhelmed god horrible vengeance let v feele owne faultes furthermore feele let v aſſure ourſelues haue wherwith comfort ourſelues leaſtwiſe ſorie ſeke hide lay opē god ſorowfully condemne may receiue mercie hand ſayd quitteth thoſe condemne ſelues burieth ſinnes haue owne eye willingly confeſſe vnto therfore let v doubt god wipe fault ſee confeſſe freely yea yet muſt paſſe way alſo namely beare mynde ſaying god puniſheth without inquiſition end euerie v dutie entering himſelf examining life throughly may aſhamed humble ſelues nowe ſayd god hauing ſo broken great mightie men doth put place againe ſide ſayd hee puniſheth open ſight yea puniſheth offender haue ſayd alreadie whereas ſaid god diſcouereth workes puniſheth ſuch ſort end ſhould alwayes ſtand awe god iuſtice imagine hee vſeth tyrannie crueltie therefore let v kepe v ſurmiſing ſuch power god ſhuld vttered without reaſon true reaſon holdeth vnknown vnto v muſt cōtented onely ſingle rule right howſoeuer world goe let v wickedly imagin god dealeth croſſely ouer thwartly iudgeth otherwiſe reaſon contrariwiſe let v fully beleeue althoughe iudgementes ſeeme ſtrange vnto v yet ordered beſt rule wit ſurmounteth rightuouſneſſe thing eliu declareth texte ſame ought ſerue cheefly v man bee afflicted owne perſon ought alwayes conſider god rightuous end may repent fault ſhal neuer haue true repentance except know god afflicteth v iuſtly neyther glorifie god confeſſe rightuous except haue firſt condemned ſelues haue ſayd thus ye ſee muſt apply oure ſelues doctrine god diſcouereth men workes bringeth light hee puniſheth verely although examine word worde
