ſinnes offence haue committed yet notwithſtanding chaſtizement whiche god ſendeth v ought profite v behalfe therfore ſayd god puniſheth inſtead wicked ſay ſuch ſort wicked ſignifie winne nothing replying alledge thing cleere themſelues ſpecially ſeeing appeere cleere men mark one point another ſayth putteth others place end ſhould know cauſe chaunges happen oftentimes worlde according alſo ſayd hundred ſeuenth pſalme right expoſition ſentence vvee ſtraught wee ſee plague vnpeople countrie happen famine land hath bin fruteful becommeth barren ſalte bin ſowne vpon elſe thing ſo troubled warres countrie layd waſte prince therof changed ſee theſe thing aſtoniſhed know god prouidence raigneth aboue worldly meanes neither thinke vpon men conſidered ſort men behaued thēſelues would thinke ſtrange god ſhould make ſuche chaunges alteration thus ye ſee expreſly ſayde god putteth place namely end wee ſee thing change worlde wee ſhoulde thinke noueltie therin god ſheweth himſelf iudge let v father vpon fortune let v aſſure oure ſelues god doth vtter arme bycauſe men mainteine ſelues poſſeſsion benefites beſtowed vpon therevpon let v conſider vnthankfulneſſe may amend ſone lord hath made v fatte ſet v vp welth byandby wee turne ſelues kicking againſt like horſes much pampered wonder god layeth hand vpon v ſeeing ſo proude vnthankfull let v marke modeſtie men nowe adayes vvhen god doth good ſo behaue thē ſelues may poſſeſſe long contrariwiſe ſpight god ende ſhould bereeue seing pride vnthankfulneſſe ſo heydous haue ſayd muſt grudge change thing great number alteration prouoke god vnto howbeit inough knowe god taketh away one people putteth another place ſetteth newe inhabiters countrey remoueth men ſort ynough ſay knowe theſe thing yea hee doth iuſtly alſo euen wee beſt ſtate let v praye graunt v grace inioy benefit ſuch wiſe wee may ſtill poſſeſſe bee guided euerlaſting heritage prepared v heauen thus yee ſee ought put ſentence vre reſt ſhall bee reſerued till tomorow let v fal downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying receyue v mercie therwithall hath humbled v vnder mightie hand made v feele iuſt correction amēdment indue v gracious gift holy ſpirit increaſe thē v till fully refourmed glorious image righteouſneſſe maieſtie ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge c cxxxiij sermon ſixth vpon xxxiiij chapter 26 ſtriketh vvicked place seer 27 bicauſe haue turned avvay haue conſidered vvayes 28 make crie poore come vnto make heare outcrie afflicted 29 vvhen ſendeth quietneſſe vvho make trouble vvhen hideth face vvho ſhall ſee vvell vpon nation vpon man ſaw yeſterday ſort god puniſheth offender without inquiſition yet notwithſtanding hath iuſte reaſon doo ſo cauſe blame nowe eliu addeth purpoſely doth place ſeers vvherein ſheweth v god iudgements ought throughly knowne vnto v euen inſtruction god puniſheth ſinners intent euery man ſhould know offence haue committed intent ſhould take example according ſayd iuſtice commeth vpon earth god doth ſo execute puniſhments correcting well thoſe notorious offender men nought ſaying added god chastiſeth offender ſight men place ſeers looker hereby warned take better heede wee haue done noting marking god iudgementes great fauour ſheweth v teacheth v men harmes wee ſhet eye play dullardes excuſe haue therfore oft god puniſheth ſinnes let euery man thinke vpon owne cace let v receyue common inſtruction end correction loſt among v ſurely cauſe one hath bene chaſticed euery man muſt haue turne could profite ſelues god ſheweth v puniſhment one man might ſerue inſtruction fiue hundred yea thouſande aſmuch wee lette warning ſlip god giueth v make account therefore euery one v called courſe muſt anſwere owne perſon puniſhed offence ſo ſee vnthankefulneſſe ſayde god puniſheth wicked breaketh peeces ſight men wee well skill talke thing whiche ſhall ſayde although wee ſee reporte taking towne ſacking diſcomfiture ſuch like thing newes ſhall caried abroade men debate much wee wel diſcourſe thing ſee eye meane purpoſe dothe ſerue v wee learne forethinke v faultes humble ſelues god wee followe ſtill owne trade although wee bad whome god ſo viſiteth correcteth ſo roughly yet wee beare ſelues hand blowes ſhal neuer come v see ye exceeding great intollerable vnkindneſſe much behoueth v marke well tolde v god puniſheth offender ſecretly ſo man might perceiue correction ſo openly v might fare better long ſelues god ſhold ſet vp ſcaffolds execute chaſticements vpō could perceyue euidently ſo blindneſſe behalfe commeth owne wilfulneſſe vnkindneſſe haue ſayde afore marke one poynt reaſon alſo ſette downe namely bycauſe turned away conſidered wayes ouer beſides wee haue ſeene already god ſtriketh men wrongfully puniſh ſinnes ſhewed v welſpring euils wit withdrawing ſelues frō fountaine righteouſneſſe life ought ſo ruled wee ſhould obey god ſeeke walke preſence therefore man gone away frō cannot run confuſion cauſe men deſtruction haue profitable leſſon text ſhewe v may keepe ſelues frō going deſtruction holding ſelues ſhet vp vnder god wing clinging vnto obey wee haue wiſedome v thing wherein welfare lieth contrarywiſe wee forget god wee ſcape hand lyfe ſtray wee vndone damnation backes ſayd god open ſight terrible maner puniſhe thoſe run away lette v marke well eliu ſpeaketh ſuch bene brought vp lawe prophet bene taught doctrine god familiarly heathen ſmall taſte light yet notwithſtanding much gaue themſelues vnto euill ſayd withdrawne god although ſo neere vnto vnto thoſe whome giuen lawe yet notwithſtanding wee muſt holde generall rule ſo muche god hath ſet v world created v owne image according order nature ought tende vnto make marke ame therefore run aſtray giue luſtes bridle ſo raigne ouer v turning away god euen ought al one ſo ſort eliu blameth paynim turning away god albeit doctrine lawe yet inſtruction haue ſpoken according alſo saincte paule declareth ſeconde romaine namely needed paper wryting ſhewe one god difference betwixt good euill euerie man hath written heart nowe heathen menne condemned ſtraying awaye god withdrawing ſelues obedience ſhall become v whome god familiar without compariſon god thought ynough haue created owne image haue printed therein ſome knowledge good euill hee hath alſo giuen v worde haue publiſhed vnto v dayly hee ſheweth v familiarly waye moyſes proteſteth wee ſtray haue excuſe ignorāce behold reſt ſayde prophete eſay therfore ſeeing oure way layed afore v wee knowe whiche way take yet notwithſtanding euerie man ſtart aſide take leaue euill wander owne affection luſtes much worthy blame thoſe neuer hearde one woorde good inſtruction heathen men called backſliders bycauſe turned away god ſeing god commeth ſo neere vnto v dutie ſcholemaſter teacher among v entertain v ſchoole end ſhuld learne hande perſon thoſe whome appoynteth preach worde name therefore wee make account doctrine giuen v muſt condemned double renegates backſlyders yes ſurely let euerie v looke neerely himſelf conſider value eſtimation grace god hath owne mouth open warrant v thing good conuenient ſaluation seeing haue although wet finger ſay yet let v aſſure ſelues deſpiſe ſuch bleſsing god muſte needes bee withdrawing ſelues much ſeeing haue worde dayly preached sermon may alſo haue lecture beſides hold v awe make v ſticke throughly god indeuer ſerue needes muſt hād vttered much roughly terrible vpō v thā vpon thoſe order nature guide aright thus much concerning poynt ſayde immediately conſidered wayes vvherin ſignified vnto v men neuer ſo ignoraunt vnskilfull naughtineſſe ynoughe make giltie bereue ſhifts god heere hath bene declared alreadie eliu ſpeaketh generally whole worlde hee iewe might haue lawe haue ſpoken like yet notwithſtanding hee ſayth thoſe whome god hath giuen naturall wit hee giuen men conſidered wayes hee ſayeth doone amiſſe erred bycauſe could better bycauſe light doctrine howbeit might haue beene ſayde heere ſpirite god ment vrge men ende ſhould knowe condemnation iuſt could alledge cloke done amiſſe throughe ignoraunce wante one gouerne whereas themſelues good vpright mynd men pure hartie deſire come vnto god ſurely would faile ſide vndoubtedly promiſe ſhal diſappoynt men knocke gate ſhall bee opened vnto ſeeke ſhall finde wee ſee men doe ſo raunge ouer feeldes run aſtray let v mark haue pure rightmeening mynde goe vnto god true maye well haue ſome ſhew deuotion ſee among papiſts many ſeeme bee beſt mynded world likelyhoode vtterly rauiſhed deuotion godward man loke narrowly vpon doings ſhall finde hypocriſie god doth giue bridle ſort without iuſt cauſe ye ſee thing haue marke texte althoughe wretched paynimes dwell darkneſſe may likened blind men grope ſe way haue nothing groſſe ignorāce yet notwithſtanding excuſed maliciouſneſſe ſtubborneſſe wilfull turning away good vnto euill euen ſet purpoſe written conſidered way god theſe thinges wyted vpon brute beaſtes vpon ſtones whiche haue vnderſtanding therefore muſt bee concluded whiche moſt rude barbarouſe euen ſay haue refuzed go right good deſire bene lefte deſtitute god grace yet therefore ſayd able well ſuch abilitie v wee bee able ſeeke god wee intreate matter papiſts make ſuch concluſions ſhewe themſelues ſtarke beaſtes ſaid men ſin ignorance certain wilfulneſſe papiſts conclude ſeing ſo foloweth haue ſufficient reaſon gouerne ſelues well wee bee cleereſighted bee ſhort haue freedome good euill great beaſtlyneſſe reaſon manner thing vnable matched togither men ſhoulde haue eye piked ſo ſhould bee able ſee diſcerne thing yet therewithall alſo altogither wicked therefore neuertheleſſe conuicted haue conſidered god wayes haue bene led right way caryed away pride ye ſee wiſe ought match one namely reaſon ſinne al v bereft reaſon vnderſtanding see heritage haue father adam myndes combered confounded ſo diſcern thing oure welfare drawe cleane according ſayd euen light turned darkeneſſe vntill god inlighten v holie ſpirite yet neuertheleſſe oure ignoraunce ſuche wee bee corrupted oure affection wype goodneſſe whiche god might put intoo v bycauſe nature froward therfore enemy vnto god oure thoughtes imagination enmity rightuouſneſſe according sainct paule ſpeaketh eyght romaine wee ignorant yet meane whyle ceaſſe frowarde vvee knowe way go yet therewithall goe aſtray wilfully mynde come vnto god wee muſt fayne bee inforced thyther elſe muſt inſpire v grace inlighten hart full rebelliouſneſſe vntill ſuche time god hath reformed v surely wee alwayes ſhet eye may ſee wayes bee ſpokē ſuch meanes god giueth vnto v ſhall become v behoueth v come backe againe point haue touched ſayde euen heathen men excuſed turning awaye god therefore muche double backſlyders ſay god drawne vnto nowe bee ſayde heathen men haue regarded god goodneſſe lyued walked accordyng godlyneſſe praye cace wee whiche haue farre knowledge gyuen vntoo lorde poynteth v finger way ſhall go texte alledged moyſes namely way walke therein greate importaunce take heauen earthe witneſſe ſayeth hee daye haue ſhewed life death goe amiſſe yee ſhall bee withoute excuſe god appeareth ſeeke owne deſtruction muche god teacheth graunteth ſuch prerogatiue declare vnto one ſhould put way handes refuſe chooſe death nowe men make ſuche choyce muſt needes become ſtarke diuels proteſtation moſes ought perce hart make v bethink ſelues better ſith ſee lorde ſetteth doctrine v whiche behoofe glaſſe liuely picture let v playe blynde bleare eyde folke nother let v drawe curten v intent bee ignorant wee ought knowe whereas deede thing manifeſt ynoughe vnto v heerewithall let v mark god ſpeaketh v leaue v doubt ſo wee ſhould knowe wordes ment contrariwiſe ende wee ſhoulde receyue good doctrine inſtruction worde another poynt well worthy marked many pretend god word ſo deepe men cannot tell take followe accuſing god ſo mocked v putting v hope deceiue v therfore let v marke wel god ſpeaketh end ſhould receiue good doctrin wee ſhould become wiſe skilfull followe thing good according ſayd word god giueth wiſdome ignorant knowing owne ſlenderneſſe may yeld thēſelues vnto ſhall alwayes find ſayd vſe owne profite worde god wee haue wiſdome deſirous goe forwarde right way ſaluation keepe v man turne aſide bycauſe hath conſidered god wayes ſaid hath erred want better abilitie contrariwiſe himſelf cauſe al euil ought wyted vpon yet one ſaying noted ſpeaketh wayes god vvherein wee aduertized ynough v content v parte ſerue halues muſt throughly wholy frame liues altogither giue eare al ſaith ſubmit man ſelfe without exception come one end vndoubtedly thoſe two commaundements inſeparable like god himſelf cannot deuided ſo alſo let v marke rightuouſneſſe deuided vvhat maner one rightuouſneſſe god hath comprehended whole lawe ſaith man ſhall abſteyne whoredome nother hath forbidden theft nother hath cōdemned murther hath ioyned ten commaundements togither haue men hold one man obey god chaſtitie another abſteining frō fleecing neighbour third keeping himſelfe dooing wrong violence taking leaue hurte harme men rending god rightuouſneſſe peeces ſaid al commaundements inſeparable holy bond ought bee kept vnbroken ſo let v marke well bliſſed god muſt take good heede ſome one part wayes thus ye ſee eliu ment note heere heereby ſee euerie man ought bee diligent looking himſelfe therefore intend examine life wel ſquare work thought haue ſound outward actuall ſinne v let v proceede ſee whether wee haue wicked affection thervpon let v learne condemne ſelues pray clenze v euill feele ſo ſelues lo howe ought practize ſentence furthermore ſhewed v alſo men haue begon ouerſhoot themſelues run aſtray become euerie day worſſe till haue renounced god quite caſte vp vve ſo malicious giue ſelues ouer al vice firſt day ſhall hild feare god take liberty runne rouers god happen winke ſinnes iniquity satan taketh poſſeſsion ſoules body thenceforth carieth v away ſuch wiſe become vtterly vnrecouerable ye ſee men haue left frame themſelues wholly god wil giue themſelues ſoūdneſſe ſimplicitie ſo appayre conſideration greeue god ſome one ſinne meanes caces ſo vtterly reiect al wayes furthermore wee ſee heere yet better afore howe rightfull god iuſtice chaſtizing v done amiſſe rebelled ſtill againſt god ranne away taught good gaue themſelues ouer vnto euill wittingly willingly high time god ſhould ſet hande correcte nowe neuer seeing ſo let v alwayes fully perſuaded god neuer puniſheth v till haue bene much prouoked anger wee haue deſerued long time afore bee thundred hand therefore followeth hath wincked v ende wee muſt needes come conteyned namely open ſight notable faſhion hee breake thoſe peeces ſo turned awaye lo wee haue beare away ſentence ſayd immediatly make crie poore come vnto make heare exclamation afflicted heere eliu noteth one kynde ſinne whiche god puniſheth men true wee offende many wayes howebeit much men bee brought knowe faultes vntill conuicted eliu hath ſet downe kinde ſinne moſt apparant eaſieſt bee ſeene outrage extortion committed ſo one man polleth another goodes greeued haue redreſſe crye oute vnto god men heare complaintes euerie bodie rueth abhorreth cace thus yee ſee one kynde wyckedneſſe whiche well known great ſmall ſee iuſtice might ouercommeth right wee dwell among theeues hee liſteth make hand pillage taketh thought hath done wickedneſſe bee bycauſe redreſſe order taken vvhen ſuche thing happen euery man ſpeake cauſe holie ghoſt hath chozen ſinne moſt notorious intent ſhould better conuicted herewithal let v marke vnder one kynde whole comprehended wiſe ſo euer offend god hath alwayes iuſt cauſe puniſh v haue declared alreadie law cannot deuided muſt continue whole one cōmaundements muſt ſo knit togither al may make one rightuouſneſſe howbeit much ſuch hypocrite euery man writheth himſelf like ſnake intent hide ſinnes god intendeth draw v force compell v confeſſe dette poore man haue wrong outrage done vnto hee aske vengeance partie cōplaints ſhall come abroad ſo ayre ſhall ring ſeeing ſo thinke hidden god think let ſlippe done firſt haue ſaid alreadie let v marke although man world complayne v yet ſinnes crie againſte v ſounde offence mount vp heauen thing bee remoued wee ſee maketh great noyſe wee breake rightuouſneſſe god wee ſhould ouerthowe houſe thinke ther anything precious order god hath ſtabliſhed make v walke according vve goe deſtroy ſayd ſhould ouerthrowe ſome building thinke noyſe commeth eares god let v marke well oft breake god lawe crie mounteth vp vnto heaue ſinnes aske vengeance v although men bee dumme open mouthes ſay thing yet ſinnes fayle bee regiſtred god lo haue marke firſt place men themſelues crie againſt v euill ſpokē oure wickedneſſe heare complaintes grudgings much reaſon ſhould thinke god heareth ſuch cry let v euery way marke nought ſayd crie sodome come vp vnto therfore come ſee whither ſo let v aſſure ſelues lord eares deaf ſo offence ſhuld alwayes come knowledge neuertheleſſe ſuch cry vpon v ſuch confuſion muſt needes note truth haue touched already thing ſmal waight go ſort ouerthrow thing lord hath ſtabliſhed good ſooth rule good life image god ſhining amongs men wee goe ouerthrowe pray confuzion howbeit let v mark way god leaue vnpuniſhed haue wrongfully vexed troubled poore true great one wexe bold ſee poore men deſtitute ſuccour ſo releeued haue freends kinſfolke ſticke thē therevpon ſeemeth vnto may doe liſt cauſe fall outrage let v marke howe ſayd god hath care therfore poore folk left vp al wrong man ſuccoreth ſo much doth god declare hee hath care reuenge well conſidered would bee leſſe haſtie trouble neighboures ſpecially thoſe make part good breaking protectiō hath ſet vpon perſons end wee muſt feele aduerſarie ſee pore man let v ſtopped harme violēce outrage god ſtep althoughe poore man beare paciently wrong done yet ſhall crie miſſe come vp heauē heard god hande like doctrine ought ſerue warning euery v may bridle himſelf abſtein frō euil ſo alſo poore ought well comforted ſith ſee god hath protection though wicked trouble vex yet god bridleth rage watcheth ouer poore end ſhewe neuer forgate ſeing god taketh quarell vpon let v refer vnto let aſſuage ſorowe greef wrongfully afflicted ſo men doe eate vsvp haue remedie ſeeme ſheepe wolues throate go lorde hath promiſed crie extorcions men doe ſhall come vp seeing wee haue buttreſſe let v contented tarie till hee ſhewe effect neere v hath care welfare lo howe wee ought practize ſentence followeth god giueth rest ſhall make trouble hideth face ſhall ſee well vpon man vpon nation eliu ment repreſſe iobs perſon quarels wee make againſt god wee would controll doings yea wee woulde couenaunt hee ſhould gouerne v owne liking truely ſay ſo yet meane ſeene haue pryde v vvhat man could finde heart abace maieſtie god ende thing might fall owne liking wee diſcontented god doth otherwiſe wold wiſh much would put barre ſay intend thing ſhall go ſo ye ſee nowe ſayd god giue rest make trouble hide countenaunce ſee nowe reſt god giueth diuers ſortes faithfull haue reſt whereof scripture ſpeaketh leane vnto god put truſt goodneſſe doubt gouerneth heerevpon may ſleepe eaſe according prophet ſpeaking thereof ſayeth euerie man ſhall ſleepe vnder figge tree vnder vine hee ſo god cuſtodie ſhall knowe peace verie frute faith holie scripture ſayth yee ſe cheefe reſt men haue inioy commit themſelues god prouidence reſpecte fatherly care ouer ſay god commit life vnto thee thy hand order thou thy pleaſure meane time kepe courſe marke one point beſides alſo another reſt god doth ſpare wicked outwardly although beat within ſo conſciences alwayes gnawe according ſaid prophet eſay although ſayd thought like waues beating one againſt another yea ſinke filthy within bicauſe vnbeleefe muſt alwayes bring vnquietneſſe yet notwithſtanding god caſteth ſleepe bycauſe hee doth puniſhe oute hande ſayde god giue reſt ſhal make trouble hereby ſhewed v god deferreth prolongeth puniſhment wicked wee muſt ouerhaſtie wee ſhall gaine nothing pleade againſt god ſay doth puniſhe offender hande much trouble thoſe whome god haue reſt therefore let v learne ſubmit ſelues paciently god beware wee runne heade ſort ſayd becommeth anye mortall creature make trouble god haue quietneſſe therewithall let v vnderſtand purpoſe haue bodily proſperitie except wee haue god fauoure feeling thereof maye make v quiet heartes againe haue quietneſſe let v vnderſtand belongeth god giue v peace w • r hand giue trouble quietneſſe liſteth trā ſitorie ſtate world much hath ſpirituall reſt far greater excellenter let v conſider lyeth v quiet oure ſelues wee bee trouble wee muſte reſorte vntoo god ſingular ineſtimable treaſure commeth holde v ſo quiet wee may alwayes middeſt turmoyles worlde abyde ſtill vpon feete toſſed great ſtormes tempeſtes yet neuertheleſſe wee may haue anker faſtned hold ſtill owne ſay ſingular priuiledge god giueth child combred full anguiſhe trouble perplexitie bee done let v take v ſettledneſſe knowing abideth within v true muſt alwayes ſeke mean god offereth v keepe v indeuer attaine howſoeuer world go let v fully reſolue v onely god office quiet v deliuer v al vnquietneſſe thing haue marke although faithfull haue ſayde peace ſo bee quiet midſt affliction miſeries world yea betake ſelues vnto god tempted diſtruſt yet let life ſubiecte much vnquietneſſe therefore let v ſtorme thoughe pleaſe god turmoyle v ſayde hee ſo handle v worlde wee muſt bee toſſed fro yet wee muſt hold ſelues faſt bee vtterly ſhaken downe temptation lo wee haue remember ſentence contrarie part ſayde god hide face ſee heerein wee warned v ſearche farre aforehande god doth wee muſt content ſelues knowledge hee ſheweth v vvhat face countenaunce god ſhape like vnto man viſage whiche hath noſe eye mouth face god record giueth v knowe wil god therefore ſheweth v face hee telleth v hee doth thing one wee ſawe oure eye contrariwiſe hee hideth face v afflicteth v thinges ſeeme ſtraunge v wee knowe reaſon hee worketh ſorte therefore god holdeth v ſo ignorance hiding face v let v marke well ſayd may well ſtraine ſelues ſee wee ſhall neuer attayne diueliſh preſumption men doe ſo enter diſputation god workes ſtorming chaſing god thing otherwiſe thinke good deſiring frame euen though woulde looke vpon whither hee hee hydeth himſelfe thoughe would pull downe may bring paſſe bee done wee may take profite ſaying truely leſſon deſerueth bee layde foorth large howbeeit time intent matter broken let v marke whenſoeuer pleaſeth god ſhewe himſelfe vnto v behoueth v knowe conſider workes ſheweth v attentiue mark reaſon doth ſo hee worketh ſtraunge faſhion vnknowne v let v reuerence ſuch ſecrets acknowledging neuertheleſſe alwayes rightuous howe ſo euer world go let v dwell continually beleef hold v quiet wayting paciently til ſhew v fully thing hidden v aſſuring ſelues life knowing muſte onely part nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele time oure life wee maye mourne deſiring forgiueneſſe acknowledging ſelues exceedingly giltie vntill hee free goodneſſe deliuer v damnation wherein wee danger wherewith beſieged ſo long world acknowledging infirmitie weakeneſſe may ſuffer gouerne v guide v right way ſaluation ſuch wiſe may neuer ſhaken downe ſo euer temptation befall v wee may ſtande ſtedfaſt calling god till haue taken v world bring v heauenly kingdome wee ſhall inioy euerlaſting reſt hath prepared v may pleaſe c cxxxiiij sermon ſeuenth vpon xxxiiij chapter 29 vvhen hee hideth face vvho hee ſhall ſee hee vpon nation vpon men togither 30 ipocrite reigneth ſtumbling blocke people 31 belongeth god ſay haue forgiuen vvill deſtroy 32 vvhiche haue receyued teache thou mee haue doone vvickedly vvill doe ſo partly declared yeſterday maner god hideth face v ſeene wit mē troubled worlde ſee reaſon ende dooings like contrarie part god graunt v grace ſee gouerneth thing perceiue fayre well diſpoſed order thoughe countenaunce ſhone vpon v sunne doe ſee ſtate worlde ſo troubled wee wote ſay one god hild face v cace v hū ble ſelues according ſayd prophet time aduerſitie wiſe man lay mouth ground hold peace verely one knowing wee ſhall gayne nothing ſtriuing god liſteth handle v ſo extremitie ye ſee end wherevnto ſentence tendeth exhorte v modeſtie ſoberneſſe bycauſe wittes rude groſſe comprehend god ſecrets moreouer bicauſe god intendeth purpoſely humble v withdraweth himſelf v done ſaith eliu well vpon whole nation vpon one man generally particularly god cā ſo intangle thing ſhal know reaſon ſpeake ſhould know end beginne better expreſsing mynde addeth ſo muche hypocrite reigneth true preſent ſentence may layde forth diuerſly ſequele texte ſheweth wel ynough meening wicked man naughtypacke reigneth ſtumbling blocke ſnare caſte among • people wordes import eyther trouble v wee ſee wicked reigne ſo nothing tyrannie equitie vprightneſſe remayning bee vtterly folorne god ſeene enormity bee committed ſo quareling ſnatching ſides ſnares bee layde ſo poore folke knowe howe ſcape god withdrawne v true neuer v hath leſſe care v howebeit wee ſee ſide able conſider done ſeemeth v god regardeth v ſee nothing darkneſſe light ought guide v ſhineth vnto v nowe ſhould ſhrinke head hold mouthes ſhet wayt god leiſure paciently til remedie inconueniences trouble v alſo let v always point neuer inquire lawful v behoueth v think well god doth ſuch thing without cauſe muſt enter conſideration ſins wee enter curiouſly diſcuſsing god ſecrets incomprehenſible determination pride wil vtterly ouerthrow v therfore haue ſaid afore let v learne otherwiſe knowing god ſomtimes lead v like poore blind ſoules touching ſentence ſaid wicked man reygneth let v marke although bee ſore temptation ſee ſuch reygne naughtypackes deſpizers god giuen euill ſee might ouercōmeth right ſo man tell whither go refuge ſurely great hard croſſe ouercome neuertheleſſe holy ghoſt intended ſet v intent ſhold armed againſt thē hath vnrightuouſneſſe gotten full ſcope wicked growne ſo iuſtie confound thing handle matter ſuch corruptiō may remedie holy ghoſt aduertizeth v god hide face maner intent trie obedience therfore let v rarie till inlighten v ſhall wee knowe hath ſent theſe trouble among v without cauſe thus ye ſee effect maner wee ought put ſentence vre eliu addeth belōgeth god ſay haue forgiuen wil deſtroy ſhould ſay god holdeth raines hand guide men pleaſure pleaſe puniſh ſinnes wee haue nothing replie ſhould condemne v hee beare v yea liſt forgiue v altogither ſhall reſiſt ſhall let ſhewe v fauour true ſtraunge man vnderſtanding firſt ſight ſeeing god accepter perſons wee aske forgiueth one rather another vvhy doth beare wicked man hee ſeene bee altogither order may well trouble heades ſeeke god dealeth maner concluſion muſt wee make ſaue onely referre thing himſelfe owne purpoſe knowing v rule yea wee able comprehende thing highe v pleaſeth god humble v hath meanes meanes ſinke naturall vnderſtanding lo effect ſayde vntoo v heere whereas heere mention made god iudgementes whereby hee chaſtizeth ſinnes let v beare minde hath beene ſayde namely rightuouſeſt man ſhall finde himſelfe guiltie twice yea hundred tymes ſuffereth therefore haue cauſe complaine furthermore pleaſe god forgiue v let v vnderſtande hee dooth deſertes thing findeth v owne free mercie ought marked well bycauſe thing haue tolde alreadie come naturally intoo men imagination hath beene cauſe bringing falſe wicked doctrine chriſtendome papiſtes ſtill imbrued errour god pardoneth ſinnes thoſe turne vntoo euen bycauſe hee ſeeth ſome good motion vvhen papiſts ſpeake forgiueneſſe ſinnes alwayes imagine man muſt owne ſyde depoſe himſelfe afore hande purchace grace god although bee full worthineſſe yet notwithſtanding muſt bee certaine meeting togither ſay good reaſon god ſeeing good diſpoſition man ſhoulde helpe reſpect ſame hath cauſed ſuch dotage bee alledged euen bycauſe men conceyue god hath ſuch libertie giuen heere wit belongeth ſay forgiue foraſmuch thing hath beene conceyued therefore papiſtes haue forged diueliſhe imagination god forgyueth thoſe whitte diſpoſed good motion purpoſe repent although haue done ſo many good deedes may deſerue accepted yet notwithſtanding god receyueth mercie bycauſe good diſpoſition hee findeth contrarily let v holde doctrine conteyned namely whereas men bee alike damnation common men ſo bee intangled god pardoneth ſome leaueth reſidue damnation wherein alreadie vvhy doth ſo v diſpute let v holde humble ſelues withall let v forge meanes owne head holy ſcripture ſpeaketh good ſooth giueth ſuch motion vnto man miſlike ſinne god hath alreadie touched holy ſpirit naturally euill wee haue committed wee ſtill diſpoſed vnto hypocriſie blindeth v flattering v ſame therefore ſinner miſlyketh ſinne token god hath already touched true cain iudas greatly greeued feeling offence miſliking nay rather gnaſhed teeth againſt god hardned themſelues euill therfore ſinner feeleth remorſe himſelf touched humble himſelf god muſt cōclude marke holy ghoſt god giue v plyable affection miſlike ſelues draw vnto token hath ſhewed v mercie ſurely good warrant mercie shall wee ſay man hath deſerued haue ſinne forgiuen god bycauſe therevnto diſpoſed wee ſee papiſts haue behalfe falſified diſguiſed god doctrine fathering thing vppon man belongeth vnto therfore ſo much better ought marke remember ſaying men haue caſt themſelues deſtruction hild thraldome ſin ſo satan poſſeſſeth none god hath authoritie ſay forgiue forgiueth muſt tie grace neither one thing let vſe owne minde diſpoſe thing according free goodneſſe therfore forgiueth one man hee may well leaue another damnation according alſo ſayd moiſes alledged saint paule recorde great importance aboue others forgiue forgiue ſhewe mercy ſhew mercy ſaying ſo god ſheweth v muſt inquyre hee doth hee cutteth away ſuch queſtions vvhom doth god pardon euen pleaſeth mortall man ordereth matter liuing god declareth hee ſheweth mercie wee muſt aske hee doth whether one man bee better diſpoſed another whether therhath beene deſert good motion meane aforehand god haue men content themſelues doings therefore whereas hee ſheweth mercie vnto ſome vnto behoueth v magnifie goodneſſe ſhew apparance iuſtice let v aſſure ſelues hee bounde vnto v vndoubtedly diuerſitie ſheweth v ſo much better whē draweth v euē death ſelfe hee dooth owne free minde wee oure part ſhoulde bee vtterly forlorne damned wee ſuccoured thus yee ſee howe wee may bee prouoked glorifie god knowe mere grace towardes v ſaluation grounded onely vpon good receyuing v mercie wit contrarie part hee forſaketh hee liſteth ſheweth like mercy letteth ſome alone ſo rayſed ſaluation thus ye ſee haue remember ſtreyne addeth destroy hath ſo pardoned herein haue one good leſſon god ſpareth ſinners reconciled vnto fully one true ſometimes god puniſheth wicked although ſinnes told thē brought remembrance ſeeme eſcaped hand time ſaying performed god deſtroy forthere forgiueth nouriſheth wicked men fat ox ſwine ende kill vve ſee oxe hath bin leane life long man intend kill hee beſtowe coſt vpon likewyſe hee swine make well larded nowe prophete vſeth ſimilitude ſhewe v ſtate reprobate deſpyſers god neuer better puniſhed hande according wee haue ſeene bothe leremie ezechiell ſuch reſerued make neuer better market long tariance worſe god haue pyled vp great heape curſedneſſe vpon heades ſo alſo muſt god poure greater rigor vpon ſo although lord puniſh firſt day yet ceaſſeth holde ſtill vnder wrath vengeance therefore text belongeth vntoo lorde dooth ſet menne quite cleare puniſhe bycauſe hath forgiuen theyr ſinnes tolde leſſon verie profitable firſt wee bee ſo fleſhly wee paſſe ſobeit god make v feele rigor although angry v reiect v baniſhe v houſe toucheth v like diſeaſed perſone good rotten inwardly bodie yet notwithſtanding one ſo long feeleth greefe vvhen man hath ague feele alteration paine heade backe well hee ouerpaſſeth yet notwithſtanding diſeaſe lurketh ſo within becommeth deadly contrarywiſe ſore athirſt good indure time remedie ague cheefe diſeaſe man ſo ſenſuall careth nothing taking away greefe paſsion preſent fitte troubleth euen ſo v although god bee offended v ſeemeth nothing wee perceyue bycauſe dulneſſe therefore wee heape ſinne vpon ſinne continue alwayes harde harted much behoueth v marke howe ſayde ſtreyne wee ſhall eſcape god hande except hee forgiue v ſinnes behoueth v go roote let v deſire god onely deliuer v ſickneſſes wantes ſuch thing let v ſpecially pray bee mercifull vnto v haue forgotten wee ſhall bee deliuered inconueniences yet better conceyuing doctrine let v marke although wee bee proſperitie yet meane god bee enimie miſcheefe ſhall continue ſtill v benefites ſhall turne bane wee vſe god giftes vntoo diſpleaſure benefites hee beſtoweth vpon v muſt turne oure greater condemnation lyke contrarie parte wee bee reconcylēd vntoo god hath pardoned oure offence although hee chaſtize v ſame ſhall bee medicine v affliction ſhall bee bleſſed ſo much ſhall turne ſaluation saint paule ſayth eight romaine beholde howe right neceſſarie poynt knowe ſhall alwayes bee ſhet vp vnder curſſe god vntill ſuch time hee hath pardoned ſinnes herevpon let v learne bee afrayde miſeries aduerſities onely ſpecially god wrath ceaſſe prouoke ſhall haue done amiſſe let v begin outward affliction ſhould ſay returning vnto god ſhould end ſhould afflict v let v pray bee ſo gracious purge clenſe v oure ſinnes ende may bee nothing v may kindle agaynſt v diſpleaſe true chaſtizementes correction god ſendeth v ſtrokes ſpurre pricke v forwarde ſeeth v dull hee driueth v meanes repentance yet muſt wee poynt ſay well content ſo god withdrawe hande mee wee muſt doo ſo wee ſhall haue gayned verie little get nothing vvhat let v go vnto god pray bee one v ſo muche v wee haue beene gently chaſtized wee maye knowe hys goodneſſe towardes v pray marke cauſe god doubleth ſtrypes ſtriketh muche roughly vppon v vvhy ſo man bee chaſtized hee feeleth god viſiteth perceyueth thing go better man humbleth himſelfe hee hath offended god deſireth bee deliuered god ſhould take away aduerſitie firſt brunt meane poore ſoule hath wit enter himſelfe ſearch owne faultes atteyne ſo much reaſon ſay ala muſt ſeeke recouer fauour god thinkes ynough preſſed like dogge doth ſhake eares hee hath ſcaped blowe cudgell one goeth ſo farre ought hee reſteth outwarde part therfore god followeth ſtriking ſtill ſee howe lightly men diſpatche themſelues god chaſtizeth make come repentaunce may well haue ſome conceyte ſame paſſeth away oute hand nowe ſith god ſeeth although man perceiue harme yet filthineſſe doth ſettle ſtill within fayne preſſe ende hee may know diſeaſe would increaſe purged bottom let v vnderſtand growe worſe worſe vntill god haue ſhewed v mercie therefore wee muſt onely deſire giue v health ſoundneſſe whatſoeuer elſe fleſh deſireth alſo blotte ſinnes gouerne v ſo holy ſpirit may bee thing v prouoke diſpleaſure agaynſt v cauſe dauid holy prophetes felte themſelues beaten tormented god hande ſay onely lorde deliuer mee affliction true deſired firſt deſyred god forgiue ſinnes angrie ſpake ſo ſawe well whence affliction come howe frutes recordes god anger therefore went alwayes roote miſchief euen ſo muſt wee thing whereof wee warned place ſayd god puniſh hath forgiuen true followeth god forgiueth v bicauſe hee maketh countenance diſpleaſure dooth winke oure ſinnes proſper though loued fauored v rather deſtruction neereſt hande according ſee howe sodomite deſtroyed come fulneſſe delightes pleaſures ſo muche deſpyſed god worlde ſo beſotted ſawe one whit vndoubtedly tooke greater libertie vnder colour god viſited long time men drunke dregges wine prophet terme wee haue ſeene ieremie ezechiell god beareth wicked ſettle lee ſoked vice bee imbrued ful remedy remorſe scripture ſayeth conſideration let v marke heape vp wood god wrath although fire put hand yet muſt wee looke thinke wee haue gayned thing except wee bee reconcyled vnto god eliu hath ſayde ſo addeth haue perceyued teach thou mee haue done amiſſe ſo theſe thing added skorne eliu bringeth god ſpeaking vnto iob offering himſelfe bee reproued amended hee haue done amiſſe true much theſe wordes ſomewhat cut men haue taken another ſenſe howbeit naturall expoſition vve haue ſeene heretofore eliu hath exalted god ſuch libertie ſoueraintie mortall menne muſt needes ſtoupe vnder open lippes hath priuiledge hee thinkes good meane muſt acknowledge al euer dooth rightfull reaſonable hee ſheweth reaſon hee intendeth reſerue authoritie ouer v himſelfe eliu therefore hath ſhewed alreadie nowe hee ſcorneth iobs ouerweening hee diſputed agaynſt god miſvnderſtoode cauſe affliction iob acknowledged ſecrete rightuouſneſſe god ought meaſured man imagination iob acknowledged meane ſeaſon wee haue ſeene paſsions toſſed ſo chafed agaynſt god oftentimes hee boyled ouer ſpake vnaduiſedly haue ſeene nowe eliu rebuketh howbeit way mockerie ſee ſayeth god muſt bee fayne come account ſay vnto thee well haue done amiſſe thou art able teache mee time better ſo ſhoulde ſay god little childe furthermore let v marke ſpoken ſo muche vnto iob vnto whole worlde haue neede ſuch warning wee knowe dulneſſe vnderſtanding god ſpeake vntoo v earneſtly grauely wee awhit moued wee ſee men wedded owne opinion haue conceyued thing eaſie turne man ſpeake plainely v maieſtie god ſhewe v howe frayle wee bee wee haue alwayes reply seeing men ſuch capacitie god ſhoulde ſhewe faultes diſtinctly grauely ſuche phraſe ſpeache might bee plainely ledde vntoo reaſon god ſeeth ſo wilfull hee muſt bee fayne mocke put ſhame folke woorthie bee ſpoken directly vnto ſee foole haue laboured winne good meanes hee ende vtterly paſt recouerie ſo hee altogither vnruly blaſphemeth god ſhall shall ſpeake hee good diſcretion ſhall ſcorne beaſtlyneſſe elſe ſee lift vp ouer great pride ſhall threaten ſame maner doth holy ghoſt proceede nowe ſayeth go god muſt bee fayne come vnto ſay haue done amiſſe amend rebuke ſurely bee ſayde v wee checke god dayly according euery man knowes findeth fault himſelfe diſcontented thing go minde effect woulde haue god turne brydle cleane otherwiſe doth ſeeing ſo malapert pray wee bee dealt wee bee mocked vpbrayded ſuch pride muſt man needes wit aduaunceth himſelfe ſort agaynſt maker maketh anie doubt ye ſee haue remember ſtreyne ſeing word ſo couched ſcorn certaine conuicted man ſpake v ordinarie ſtile vttered maner go god ſhall come ſay haue done amiſſe rebuke mee ſhewe mee leſſon ſhame v bee ſo ſpoken yes ſurely vvhat muſt god come downe v confeſſe faulte ſubmitte himſelfe correction wee ſee deteſtable monſtrouſneſſe none v heares woulde ſtande ſtaring vpon heade heare ſpoken yet notwithſtanding oure doings tende vvhen menne frette chafe ſort haue touched alreadie make vagary woulde make god ſubiect ymagination one would bereeue ſoueraintie ſubdue ſuche lawe lyſted laye vppon though hee little babe men therefore vndirectly thing woulde bee loth afrayde heare ſpoken ſo wee ſee holy ghoſt hath taken good waye ſpight diueliſh malapertneſſe v murmure ſo agaynſt god hee ſayeth go ſee god muſt faine come aske forgiueneſſe contented taught haue ſhewed ought ſo ſo holy ghoſt ſpeaketh ſort ſhewe men verie diueliſh preſuming maner ſet vp briſtles agaynſt god murmure hee worketh lyking much therefore ought wee wey well wordes conteyned oft wee bee tickled intent bee inquiſitiue god doings bring vnder coram let v conſider maze enter one would rob god maieſtie abace world make ſubiect thinke good▪ ala great deſpyzing whether go therefore ſuch thing commeth minde thinke v ought let v remember ſaying thou grudge maner thou ſetteſt thy ſelfe agaynſt thy god beholde holy ghoſt hath alreadie declared told thee confuzion thou putteſt thy ſelfe namely much thou wouldeſt become creator thy god malapertneſſe wert thou worthie drowned bottom hel greater pride deſire darken rather aboliſh maieſtie god thou ſilly worme earth thou curſed creature thou wretched cariō thou art ſink filthineſſe wilt thou take vpō thee check ſo againſt thy maker vvhen haue ſuch thought v let v beware put away yea vtterly burie ſhet fanſies doores ſtand vpon reputation ſay lorde bee thou glorified ignorance let v ſay nothing elſe lorde thou art rightuous thy doings although wee ſee awhit nowe wee ſhall one day bee inlightened thee nowe great wiſedome v reſt ſimplie vpon ſeeing haue v ignorant tyme ye ſee ſtandeth v hande put ſentence vre furthermore whereas ſayde teach god thing perceyueth behoueth v make compariſon betweene god v hath bin euerlaſting ſnayles one dayes breede yet wee put horne immediatly water vvherof ſnayles made wherof come ye ſee ſnayles chaunged incontinent meet ſhoulde poke horne agaynſt god ſtrength courage haue cōtinuance time bee threeſcore fourſcore yeares worlde ſpeake eldeſt ſort vnderſtanding cōtrary part let v mark continuance god wiſedome knowledge euerlaſting worlde made thing preſent hee hath increaſed wiſedome neither abated thing knewe thing euen world made muſt men needes bee worſe madde giue theyr affection head ſort ſay matter ought haue gone thus hath god conſydered thing ought done wiſe ynough himſelfe ouerturning marring thing like mortall men except haue debated vpon matter afore hande taken counſell nothing good profitable hath god neede conſult hath neede debate matter aforehande ſhould ſayd afore thing haue bene preſent tymes vvhat done thē ſuffer ſelues taught knowing vnderſtanding v glide worlde life vaniſheth away ſhadowe blinde wretch although bee ſome reaſon vnderſtanding v yet able guide v muche leſſe aduiſe god ſhould ſerueth make v vnexcuſable ſo reaſon wee haue ſtandeth v ſtead conuict v condemne v therewithall holy ſcripture ſheweth v wee bee blinde wretch yea wee ſufficiently taught experience therefore take vpon v teache god whither wee ruſhe cauſe ſayde behoueth v knowe firſt ignorance ſecondly belongeth vntoo god diſpoſe thing wee vnderſtande want ſelues may bee doubt belongeth vnto onely remedie lack vnderſtanding let v craue ſayeth saint iames welſpring giueth without vpbrayding god dealeth nigardly v men doo goodes diminiſh greeued much called vpon ſo god neuer ceaſſeth v good therefore let v learne offer ſelues vnto wee want wiſedome let v doubt hee giue v much ſhall bee neceſſarie v doctrine whiche haue touched exceedingly behoofe hath bin cauſe ſo many corruption chriſtendome inſomuch good doctrine hath bin peruerted imbaced bycauſe men haue bene deſirous bee ouer wiſe though god bene well aduiſed vvhen men preſume put forth owne inuentions ſay bee good muſt done ſuch thing muſt bee remedyed ſort owne fancie god foreſeene howe happeneth afore vvee ſee god pronounceth theretoo muſt hold v haue v receiue thing good holy ſpeaketh beholde men ſtep play ſticklers rowe betweene twooſtreames could finde hart god ſo much wrong ſay ſcarce wel aduiſed themſelues wizer ſhall knowe thing better taking thing groſſe eaſie bee vnderſtoode pope hath gone deuide thing god hath ioyned togither wit hee hath bereft people cup lord ſupper told muſt content themſelues one kind namely oſte cup ſerued prieſt ſing maſſe withall alledged hee woulde many inconueniences true thoſe inconueniences grounded vpon beaſtly ſuperſtitions make men beleeue wyne wyne turned bloud lorde ieſus chriſt marke heere allegation pope ſayeth would many inconueniences cup ſhould giuen people better prieſt ſhould drinke behalf whole company ſhort one ſayd bee wiſer god ſee thing ſaw therefore muſt prouide maner putting away ordinance ieſus chriſt beholde lorde ieſus chriſt ſayth drinke ye cup ſayeth expreſſely drinke ye behold pope commeth cutteth worde ſaying true ſo ordinance ieſus chriſt haue without good reaſon prouide inconueniences haue foreſeene ſo ſhal ſay god ſonne infinit wiſedome ſelfe light worlde ſee nothing making inſtitution vve ſee men ouerſhoote themſelues beyond al meaſure whē conſider god doings brought infinite rightuouſneſſe wiſdome let v hold v follow way ſheweth v afrayde ſhall erre ſhewe v ſuffer ſelues gouerned quietly nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele better haue done ſo may ſorie aske forgiueneſſe therwithall may knowe help v put ſelues mercie hee may ſpare v ſome little time ſo may bee alwayes vphild power ſo aſſured mercy may doubt guide v euen vnto ende vntill haue deliuered v aduerſities miſeries wherevnto ſubiect may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c cxxxv sermon eight vpon xxxiiij chapter 33 vvill god performe thing thee thou haſt miſliked wilt thou chooze vvhat knovveſt thou ſpeake 34 ye men vnderſtanding ſpeake let vviſe men heare mee 35 iob hath ſpoken vviſdome neither hath vvords bin vnderſtanding 36 deſire iob ſhoulde bee tried vtter moſt ende vve might ſee anſvveres men vvickedneſſe 37 vvill multiplie ſinnes iniquitie vaunteth himſelfe agaynſt v multiplieth vvordes agaynſt god haue ſeene heeretofore god ſcorne mennes folly offered heare mennes counſell ſaying hee vnderſtoode thing ſhewe done amiſſe would ſo therevpon declared without cauſe god ſo ſcorned preſumptuouſneſſe ſee men exalt themſelues agaynſt take vpon controll euery turne therfore god hath neede dandle maner eliu ſetteth forth maieſtie god ſaying performe thing thee like heretofore hee dalyed ende men might know better fonde ouerweening ſo alſo contrarie part ſheweth dalying ſo great lorde god wee haue replied neuer ſo much meete hee ſhould ſubiect luſtes shoulde aske counſell handes knowe ſhoulde vvere ouerthrowing whole order nature wee ſee howe holy ghoſt hauing declared men worthie bee ſpoken vnto reaſon grauitie doth nowe touche quicke euen ſetting maieſtie god eye telling v ſet lawe rule thus much importeth ſaying hee performe thing thee although men ouer labour themſelues yet ſhall winne ſo much god ſhould yeeld vnto bee ſubiect pleaſure therefore ſpight teeth muſte paſſe waye god hath appoynted according hee liſteth diſpoſe thing wee ſay v rule matter true might bee obiected eliu doth ſufficiently defende god rightuouſneſſe alledging mightie power behoueth v beare minde howe hath bin declared afore god mounted vp ſeate hee doth glorie abſolute lawleſſe power hee therewith iudge world nothing peculiar vnto equitie vprightneſſe inſomuche hee bereft owne ſide cace ſtandeth heere vpon ſhewing god intendeth making men feele owne frailtie therfore comparing thing contrarie one ſide god ſheweth al power belongeth vnto without exception ſide warneth v cōſider well ſelues ſinfulneſſe beware mortall man worme earth ſhoulde take ſo ſtoutly vpon dare ſtande contention god deſire ouerrule ſurely ſo often murmure againſt god cannot accept thing good worth come wee knowe let v mark wel holy ghoſt doth bring men backe owne ſtate neuer durſt bee ſo bolde grudge agaynſt god except forgotten themſelues vvill lowly mild glorifie god becommeth vs▪ let v enter ſelues examin well nature knowe bee men holde v ſhort preſumption thus wee ſee wee haue beare away text ſayde thou haſt miſlyked thou ſhalt chooze heere againe ſtreyne god brought complayning men pryde pleading ſo agaynſt ſurely cannot content themſelues god doo miſlyke doings meanes pretend haue choyze election though free ſaye well done god muſt leaue ſo true would abhorre ſuch blaſphemies ſhould demaunded whether v would take vpon let god executing determination euerie v would anſwere god forbid euer ſhoulde intende aduaunce ſelfe ſo diueliſhe pride haynous blaſphemie yet meane wee haue tongs filed find fault whenſoeuer god doth thing contentation ye ſhall ſee v grinde teeth make complaint neither ſhall wee haue neede haue gone ſchoole learne rethorick grudge againſt god plaine miſlyking doings poynt men yeeld quietly god good mynde haue choyze thing ſaye god muſt thus god muſt page beholde outrageous vice raigneth euerie yet men indeuour put awaye amende much ought wee marke well text howe god commeth owne quarell agaynſte v ſayeth wretched creature intend ſee murmure dayly vvheras cheef poynt haue obey myne ordinaunce take good woorth holde peace humble ſelues afflict ſo farre dooing none ryſeth vp agaynſt mee muſt bee ſubiect vnto vvhat reaſon alledge ſhould bound vnto seeing god brought ſort surely wee worſe blockiſhe touche moue v though oure heartes ſwolne lyke toades yet ſhoulde fylthineſſe bruſt oute thoughe harde rockes yet ought clyue aſunder whereas god addeth miſlyke mee miſlyke fall accuzing ſort wee finde faulte rightuouſneſſe vvhere welſpring light god woulde wee reiect doings vvhether go agayne importeth therewithall wee woulde haue ſouerayne dominion ouer hee ſhould owne libertie ſhould wee thinke good cauſe hee ſayeth ſhalt thou chooſe bycauſe menne cannot finde theyr hart condemne themſelues except bee compelled heere god addeth concluſion knowest thou ſpeake ſhoulde ſay hee reproueth v ignorance tongue bee nimble may bee haſtie ſpeake thing haue conceyued god telleth v one droppe reaſon wee ſhoulde bee dumme man ſpeake hee wote ſure recorde folly yet notwithſtanding wee bee talking inſomuch oure lorde needeth croſſe v ſomewhat miſ •• keth vs▪ whetteth v murmure agaynſt nowe let bee knowne wee skill whereof talke v throughly examined ſhall bee nothing founde ignoraunce many wordes little wit tongue ſhall runne vpon pattins meane reaſons ſhall bee vtterly ſenceleſſe raſhneſſe vvee ſee howe waightie concluſion god knowest thou ſpeake ſhoulde ſay giue leaue ſpeake ſobeit ſhewe doings bee wiſe men menne vnderſtanding ſtarke fooles nothing ignoraunce muſt take vpon ſuch libertie ſpeake haue ſaye nowe wee make profite ſtreyne conteyneth good leſſon firſt wee ſee rule lyfe namely yeelde god due authoritie hee may diſpoze v ſay may thing yet aduice v ſet god lawe • nd poynt leſſon muſt agree vnto doeth marke one poynt true wee may well demaunde thing thinke glory welfare church owne priuate benefit ſheweth ſuch familiaritie towardes v ſay vnto v diſcharge hart care according alſo saint paule ſayeth wee muſt make priuie deſyres therefore wee bee vnquietneſſe let v referre ſelues vnto god pray thing wee thinke good howbeeit let v rule ſelues alwayes worde notwithſtanding pleaſe graunt deſires yet muſte wee vſe thankeſgiuing sainct paule ſayeth ſame place deſires muſt headie neither muſt conſtrayne god require contrariwiſe although hee ſay v nay minde therein excercize pacience let v alwayes bliſſe glorifie name acknowledging hee doeth thing ineſtimable iuſtice vprightneſſe wiſedome wee ſelues knowe good poore blinde wretch therefore hee muſt bee faine ſee v thus yee ſee firſt poynt wee haue marke heere put vre ſtreyne god muſt thing appoyntment howbeeit ſtretcheth yet witte wee finde thing scripture whiche ſtraunge vnderſtanding let v aſſure ſelues wee muſt leane ſo owne reaſon god ſhoulde wee thinke ought bee done let reigne let men ſtoupe vnto hee ought aske counſell v behoueth angel heauen menne vppon earth humble themſelues god onely beare ſway yea euen ſuch freedome bee confeſſed belongeth doo whatſoeuer doth ſide warned cannot worſe thing repine grudge god thing fall wee would wiſh them▪ miſlyking onely rule rightuouſneſſe thing man fall euill amiſſe frailtie hee therefore bee excuſed commeth ſuch fulneſſe ſinne hee contented offende god breake lawe aboliſhe order alſo would quenche god rightuouſneſſe haue light turned intoo darkneſſe ſo might bee diſcerning betweene good euill oueroutrageouſneſſe yet notwithſtanding often men repyne god cannot paciently beare dooings glorifie therein miſlyke though woulde vſurpe authoritie ouer iudge alſo condemne rightuouſneſſe outrageous beaſtly dealing therefore wee bee tempted grudging impacience let text come remembraunce let v ſay thou wretched creature doeſt thou vvhat maze entereſt thou intoo ſimple temptation puſhing wyth horne agaynſte god thinkeſt thou blot rightuouſneſſe vvith doeſt thou matche thy ſelfe fleſhe bee ſo itching make v bende oure ſelues agaynſt god let bee barre holde v backe ſuffize let v adde thus muche greate malapertneſſe v deſyre chooze ſpecially taking awaye god choyce menne ſhoulde haue libertie ſay muſt bee done god ſhoulde haue ſoueraintie gouerne v hee lyſteth twoo thing cannot ſtande togither vvee agree god fire water vvee bee verie well ſighted looke halfe finger length v wee dazeled ſoone wee open oure eye commonly wee iudge thing bee euill good deſires corrupt ſo affection thought thē ſhould agree god infinite incomprehenſible wiſdome vnto whoſe rightuouſneſſe behoueth v bee ſubiect seeing ſuch contrarietie betweene god men haue choyce god muſt packing elſe tyed ſtake luſts muſt bee like chaynes cordes ſay thou ſhalt ſtir preſumptuouſneſſe wee bee tempted grudge afflictiōs thing▪ ſtate worlde order ſo thing fall liking let v thinke thus ſelues true may wiſh thing thy god giueth thee leaue aske ſo done humilitie ſubiection whē thou haſt made thy requeſt thou muſt hold thy ſelf quiet though thing fal thy liking euen though thy god ſeeme minded greeue thee ſet purpoſe yet muſt thou yeeld behalf play beaſt seing ſo let v mark well ſentence lorde ſayeth vvhat whither would go ſhall haue choyce ſhall meddle one would bereeue god beeing abace ſuch wiſe might maiſters ouer verie nature teacheth v contrarie often wee murmure maner ſtorme thing bycauſe fall wee woulde wiſhe much would thruſt god vnder feete true think yet muſt fall ſuch blockiſhneſſe let v thinke vpon thing enter ſayde conſideration ende bee ſo rebellious ende let v alſo marke well ſpeech ſayde knoweſt thou ſpeake haue touched alreadie wee meane twit man foole ſay thou knoweſt thou ſayeſt wote ſay followeth wee knowe nothing doubt skill throughly tryed ſearched top toe bee founde nothing v dotage maketh v go aſtray yet that▪ muſt alwayes pratling whatſoeuer come ſpeake thoſe follow owne ſenſualitie well ſayde haue beleued therfore ſpeak marke howe may ſpeake wizely wit vttering haue learned god ſchoole word good ſpeaking allowed god yea ſacrifice good ſauour vnto namely confeſſe thing good hath ſhewed v reſt wholy vpon ſaying yee ſe • wiſe wee haue ſpeake man aduaunceth throuſteth foorth himſelfe ſpeake ſoeuer hee hath ymagined owne brayne ſo hee checketh agaynſt god knoweſt thou let man trie well thy ſtrength vnderſtanding thy mind ſhall finde ſtark folly therfore whenſoeuer tongue lauiſhe talke let v remember ſayde knoweſt thou certaine place lorde ment condemne man wit like place holy scripture ſayd god knoweth thought men vaine ſercheth ſecrets ouertaketh wilie wilineſſe men maye well beare themſelues hande bee ſharpwitted ſuttle yet ſmoke vaniſheth away ſtrayght text lord ſayth go haue wiſedome ſhewe haue skill ſpeake heere haue generall doctrine▪ muſt clayme thing owne wit truſt vnto therefore oft wit runneth rouers ſo wee preſume talke iudge matter reſhly let v aſſure ſelues holy ghoſt ſetteth himſelf againſt aduerſarie partie ſheweth nothing fooliſhe raſhneſſe v wee haue skill true god hath giuen v reaſon vnderſtanding onely v wit light god ſhyneth darkneſſe purpoſe make v vnexcuſable inſomuch wee haue knowledge except god ſpeake vnto v inlighten v worde way whereby may menne vnderſtanding according ſayde pſalme wiſedome profite vnder therfore let v marke muſt vtterly diſtruſt owne reaſon knowe till lorde haue inlightned v worde vtterly voyd diſcretion neither modeſtie honeſtie v lo haue beare minde furthermore ſpeake let v ſure aforhande lord hath taught v wee haue thing wee vtter imagined owne brayne well practized ſhould ſee world another order two thing diſplace right one wiſe owne conceyts▪ wee giue bridle affection luſtes wee knewe well thing ſpoken heere wit haue skill al ſpeaking bewray▪ owne folly ſay wee throughly perſwaded doubt god ſhould exalted men would hold themſelues word ſo ſhould one cōmon accord would ſomuch diſputing proofe hereof papiſts debate ſo much vpon article controuerſie betweene v bycauſe cannot finde hart bee ſubiect vnto god alſo bycauſe bee ſo ſawcie ſtep forth lordly concluſions determine binde men conſciences reſolutions papiſts coulde hold themſelues pure ſimplicitie god worde ſurely wee ſhoulde one minute houre agree vpon thing doubt day againe touching theſe phantaſticall heades creepe amongſt v defile pure doctrine pray whereof commeth diueliſhe pride cannot finde harte receyue thing quietly holy scripture ſpeaketh man aske theſe madde heades woulde nowadayes aboliſhe god free election alſo prouidēce ſuch like thing reaſon haue anſwere thinkes verie ſtraunge ye beaſts though man ſharpeſt witted skilfulleſt could ſo paterne cunning learning yet hee ſillie worme earth finde faulte god doings behold theſe ſtark beaſts haue nothing pride wherewith readie burſt ſtincking poyſon yet notwithſtanding take vpon thē ouerturne holy scripture vnder colour ſaying perceiue cace haue ſayde let article bee marked men haue skill ought holde peace kepe ſilence ende god alone may exalted vvere doctrine throughly put vre ſurely wee ſhould ſee quiet obedience v woulde ſay amen whenſoeuer pure truthe god layde afore v ſecond miſcheef affection vnruly giue leaue run rouers reaſon wherof god afflict v thing fal looking fal ſtormiug euery man caried away worſe ynough v take libertie ſpeake agaynſt god alſo ſeemeth ſeeke occaſion rayle iuſtice bee agreeable fanſies vve ſee time therfore ſo much behoueth v marke haue ſayd namely ſentence put well vre ſhould ſee angelical order world vvhat done let v followe owne reaſon attempt thing vpon owne heade contented bee taught god againe ſyde affection carie v away bitterneſſe ſo greeued vexed let v ſhake thoſe thing bycauſe good reaſon god ſhoulde reigne haue al ſuperioritie ouer v ſhould obey confeſſe doings good rightfull glorified v acknowledge ought gouerne v alſo hee doeth rightfully thus ye ſee wee haue note furthermore whenſoeuer finde men aduaunce themſelues ſort againſt god let v vnderſtand maner deſperate vnrecouerable ſith cannot ſubmit themſelues good god acknowledge ſame good rightfull therefore let example teache v humble ſelues ſay ala aſmuche woulde betide thee thy god preſerued thee whence commeth modeſtie holy ghoſt thou ſeeſt nature euery v ſeeing cace ſtandeth ſo wee ſee theſe light headed perſons doo ſo aduaunce thēſelues paſſe bound againſt god let euerie v thinke muche might befall mee withhilde ſpirit god ſo gouerned mee make mee meeke might glorifie take good woorth whatſoeuer hee ſendeth mee lo herein effect haue remember ſentence ſayde conſequently let men hart ſpeake ſo ſay let men vnderſtanding ſpeake let wiſe men herken heere firſt ſight eliu ſeemeth ſpeake thing contrarie ſpeake herken agree togither yet notwithſtanding without cauſe hee willeth wiſe men ſpeake men vnderſtanding herken man ſhall neuer ſpeake well except willing heare neither ſhall euer fit teach vnleſſe bee willing alſo receyue good doctrine vve ſee eliu matcheth two thing togither whiche ought neuer bee ſeparated aſunder thing haue ſpoken afore namely may well ſpeake howbeit haue learned afore haue beleeued ſayeth pſalme therefore haue ſpoken therefore behoueth v keepe leſſon howe beleeue vnleſſe haue giuen • ſuffered ſelues taught muſt teachable good thing ſet afore v according alſo ſayde wiſe man ſhall become wyſer hearing ye ſee heere ſaying salomon ſheweth full well ſpeake let man ſhoulde herken according alſo herken let man may ſpeake wherefore lord maiſter intent ſhuld heare euerie v teache neighbour thereby make thing auaylable wee haue receyued god haue giuen mee gift grace bounde vtter neighbour ſee amiſſe ſpeake hearken twoo thing onely agree verie wel alſo inſeparable leaſtwiſe thing well diſpoſed conſidered good order true ſpeaking heere ſet foremoſt neuertheleſſe eliu ſayeth wizemen therein preſuppoſeth whiche ſpake firſt learned afore knew ſay againe whereas ſeconde place ſetteth downe ſhould herken doo v wit ſpeaking muſt ſuch maner muſt neuertheleſſe giue eare another man hath ſpeake god hath reuealed v according alſo sainct paule ſetteth downe order prophecying let prophete ſaith ſpeake let two three auoiding confuſion calleth prophet ſheweth behoueth haue ſay none muſt thruſt himſelfe forth vnleſſe bee called like hee ſayth xij chapter firſt corinthian haue receyued thing lordes hande communicate neighbour muſt man take vpon office church except hee called haue wherewith furniſhe roome recorde god ſerued v dealeth gracious giftes v holy ſpirite paule declareth preſuppoſeth ſuche ſpeake furniſhed aforehande neuertheleſſe addeth god hath reueled another man firſt muſt hold peace giue roome ſpirite god thus ye ſee ſayd although wyſe men ſpeake god alloweth alſo bee furniſhed wherewith yet notwithſtanding muſt alſo harken contented hold theyr peace another man ſpeaketh better prophet alwayes yeeld themſelues ſubiect holy ghoſt fountaine vnderſtanding alſo although man haue receyued large giftes grace yet doeth god deale vnto meaſure intēt abridge al occaſion aduancing ourſelues much though man might ſufficient himſelf god therfore hath ſet band loue among v one v ſhould haue neede another behoueth v mainteyne brotherly communicating cauſe except rebel againſt god behooueth v willing receyue good doctrine hāds although god haue inlightened v word neuertheleſſe certayne heere eliu intendeth reprooue iob ſayd iob hath ſhewed himſelf euill taught ſurely althoughe iob man greate learning yet ſo caried away paſsions manner dulled wordes order thing eliu ment ſay ſtreine haue good admonition gather firſte iob whome god indued ſo greate grace bee condemned man voyde wit reported haue bin exceſsiue paſsions yea although hee ſtreined himſelfe repreſſe yet notwithſtāding toke much libertie wandred beaſtly word bee thought v let v take heede preuent condemnation whenſoeuer oure minde ouerſore ſhaken ſo haue fretted againſt god would haue entred diſputation pleading agaynſt let v end ſuffer ourſelues reproued holy ghoſt iob angell compariſon v ſpared ſhall bee specially ſeing ſo heady vnruly wee wil yeeld one poynt inforced know proceede hande god mindes ſo lofty wee woulde rule heauen earth woulde ſay correct magnificat seeing ſo bolde ſhall done v shall blamed hundredfold iob thing ought make v ſory heart ſee paſſions ſo outrageouſe furthermore haue marke generall man ſhall neuer meete teach except hee humilitie ſuffer men reproue hath done amiſſe lo howe god intendeth hold v awe text therfore let euery mā apply owne inſtruction ſayd men vnderſtanding muſt aſwell heare ſpeake muſt haue vnderſtanding neuertheleſſe wee ſee adayes wiſe ſpeake harken haue ſpoken bee haue full ſcope ſpeake babble make men holde theyr peace vvitleſſe folke whome nother skill diſcretion iudgement drunckarde dulled gluttonie inſomuche hee riſeth morning hee hath ſcarſe diſgeſted euenings wine ready go tauerne playeth beaſt day double beaſt night suche man ſhall nowadayes haue free libertie ſpeake men muſt keepe ſilence afore giue hearing howe full ſhamfull vve ſee haue leaſt ſhame haue moſt libertie ſpeake ſuch men vnderſtanding muſt haue mouthes ſhet may wiſe bee broughte lightheaded diſordered folke cheefe al miſcheefe deſpyſers god haue full ſcope true although wittieſt men worlde ſober ſettled minde yea alſo greate skill yet certayne ſhould alwayes beaſtes haue feare god beholde deſpizers god ſtarke beaſtes drunkard glutton vnthrifts ſuche haue nother honeſtie ſhame euen thoſe haue ſayd nowadayes royſt thoſe ſpeake liſt mā ſo bold quetch againſt lo poynt agayne bee hearde howe dare man nowadayes tell men faultes althoughe ſinnes bee howge mountaynes yet may man ſee man ſay howe nowe ought ſuche thing bee borne withall anſwered hah ſee ye wretched beaſts ye eye ye leſſe condemned ſufficiently conuicted none hath ſting conſcience ſhort although ther nother preaching warning thing elſe yet heartbytings gnawe within might make ſee nothing euill yet aske ſtill hah far putting doctrine vre ſaid let wiſe men ſpeake let men vnderstāding heare vvhereas none fooles witleſſe folke mad men haue libertie ſpeake binde men ſtake ſo haue authoritie yeelded yet notwithſtanding haue eares heare receyue correction man woulde tell fault ſuche cannot abyde bewraying neuertheleſſe wee go agaynſte thing god hath ſtabliſhed oure ſtryuing ouerthrowe ſhall bee vayne harde wall v therefore lette ſuche ruſhe agaynſte aſſure ſelues ſhall ruine deſtruction lo wee haue beare minde therefore ſith knowe howe thing confounded nowadayes lette v learne returne thether god calleth v whiche doctrine ſhoulde bee heard take place amongs v ſo v ſhoulde diligent receyne knowes hee hath done amiſſe ſhould ſeeke amend meanes myght doo honour ought haue ſouereyntie ouer v conſider iob condemned gyuing himſelfe brydle muche hee mortified affection hilde ſufficiently awe ala ſhall become v let v thinke vpon aſhamed ſee wretchedneſſe hath reygned muche amongſt v pray purpoſe v ſpeake reformation goſpell meane ſeaſon wee ſtryue ſort againſt god whereas wickedneſſe hath full ſcope nowadayes ſo farre men frō repreſsing rather mainteyned tooth nayle inſomuch man take vpon ſpeake ſhew faultes lambe doth alwayes trouble water theſe ſtinking goates croude thēſelues intoo god churche trouble defile holineſſe god hath ſet amongs v word meane whyle theſe ſilie lambes muſte accuzed though cauſe euill sith wee ſee let v learne ſtrengthen incourage ourſelues wee ſee euill others may take heede bee alſo ourſelues furthermore whē feele lord graunteth v grace ſubmit ourſelues vnto mildneſſe ſo ſuffer ourſelues bee taught although ſee wickedneſſe raygne onely let v cōſent vnto alſo let v reſiſt ſtoutly vttermoſt power diſſembleth draweth curten eye whē wickedneſſe rangeth abrode deuill carieth away vnderlings ſort gilty god iudgemente hee maynteyned euill thus ye ſee ought practize doctrine wee god dewe ſeruice acknowledge lord ſouereygne ouer monarchy principality worlde nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v repente beeing gouerned holy ſpirite may fight manſully agaynſt temptation affliction worlde whyle ſhall pleaſe keepe v heere wee may ſeeke bee altogither ſubiect holye commaundementes ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confeſſe according truth wee woorthie lifte vp eye heauen preſent ſelues thee preſume ſo farre prayer c cxxxvj sermon firſt vpon xxxv chapter eliu proceedeth ſaying 2 diddeſt thou thinke aright vvhen thou ſaydeſt rightuouſneſſe aboue god 3 thou haſt ſayd vvhat ſhall profit mee vvhat ſhall auayle mee haue ſinned 4 vvill anſvvere thee thy freendes likevviſe 5 looke vp heauens behold looke vp ayre aboue thee 6 thou ſinneſt vvhat doſt thou againſt thy ſinnes multiplied vvhat hurteſt thou 7 thou rightuous vvhat giueſt thou vvhat ſhall receyue thy hande eliu continueth heere ſtill blame iob ſor blaſpheming ryghtuouſneſſe god groundeth vpō poynt iob ment owne rightiouſneſſe ſurmounted god vttered thoſe word pretended thing cauſe hee mainteyned owne rightuouſneſſe ſuch wiſe though god tormented wrong fully without cauſe therevpon ſhoulde haue inſued god dealte reaſonably afflicted meaſure howbeeit better conceyuing hereof behoueth v call mind hath bene ſette downe heeretoofore vvhen iob ſpake owne ryghtuouſneſſe onely ende ſhewe hee puniſhed offence hee ought bee iudged wicked bycauſe god afflicted ſo greeuouſly aboue men haue told god afflicting men hath alwayes eye puniſhing theyr ſinnes intendeth trye pacience bee ſell vnto iob god gaue satan brydle bycauſe iob naughtye packe prouoked god wrath greate offence although satan founde faulte yet notwithſtanding obteyned leaue torment cauſe god afflicted iob ſorte angrie intended trye obedience might mirrour vnto v therefore iob fought well ſaying puniſhed offence ſome reſpect therein deſerueth condemned faulte beeing troubled vehemencie paſsions thought firſte god vſed meaſure ſo ſore agaynſte poore creature oughte bee puniſhed ſorte ſo hee murmure behalfe true iob flattered himſelfe infirmitie yet ſo good ſtay himſelfe hee ought haue agayne greateſt miſcheefe hee thought vppon nothing anguiſhe inſomuche tymes fayth choked hee looked heauenly life reward promiſed faythfull theyr manfull fighting coulde atteyne bycauſe forepoſſeſſed greefe troubled vtterlye ouer whelmed yee ſee iob confeſſeth ryghtlye generall god hath prepared euerlaſting heritage cannot fayle thoſe wicked alſo cannot ſcape hande although triumphe world take pleaſure heere yet ſhall pay deere iob knewe theſe thing generall hee ment apply doctrine himſelfe coulde bring paſſe bycauſe hearte diſtreſſed hee ſtormed muche vvhen hee afterdeele hee gazed coulde ſee three foote afore without dazeling eye wit ſorte bereſt cauſe could cōfort himſelf hope reſte promiſed hee aſſuaged anguiſhe remitted himſelf vnto god ſay euen ſo lorde yet haue alwayes hoped thou wilt make mee feele ſuch ſhall haue ſuffered affliction paciently ſhall happy end lord thou giueſt mee knowledge ſuch waite vpon thee ſhall neuer diſappoynted hope thou wilt ſtill prouide al aduerſities giue good end although thy helpe appeare hand yet wilt thou neuer fayle iob ought haue thought theſe thing paſsion hild pryſon fayth ſayde afore manner choked like wether bee ſore troubled darke wee ſhall peraduenture haue ſome manner light yet ſhall wee ſee whyt farre darke cloudes doo dimme eye ſo wee cannot diſcerne thing euen ſo v bee afflicted according experience ſheweth man vexed conſcience hee ſeeth nother funne moone darke vnto true hee holde ſtill principle whiche faythfull oughte haue ſo hee ſhall knowe god goodneſſe yet hee take comforte cheere vp himſelfe middes ſorrowes hee cannot conclude thus himſelfe go yet holde ſtill god reacheth mee hande ſhall get oute theſe diſtreſſes perplexity wherein man therfore ſo preſſed vp anguiſh god afflicteth maketh feele ſinnes diſmayed cannot come ſo farre ſay god hath declared drawe ſeruaunts graue therefore although ſeeme bee vtterly ouerwhelmed yet god mighty power diminiſhed towards mee lo taking iob althoughe hee knewe heauenly life prepared v oure heritage wee ſhall haue euerlaſting ioye yet coulde hee comfort himſelfe affliction ouerraught much affliction made feele god hande agaynſte eye ſorte blindfolded wittes ſo amazed coulde cheere comfort himſelfe take holde god promiſes ſuche taſte ſame might aſſuage miſeries leſſon well woorthy noted ſee continually afflicted hartgreefes wee ſo amazed man giuen v knocke vpon heade beetle yea wee may well haue ſome feeling thereof alſo bodily affliction winter greate froſte ſo bee able maner ryue ſtones could finde heart fire wee haue preſente paſsion eye wee haue forgotten quite heate meeneth cleane contrariwiſe ſommer ouerwhote wold full yce come mind aſmuch paſsions muche exceſsiue doubte able oppreſſe v muche yee ſee alſo howe wee ought go ryght foorth vnto god wee myght bee comforted imbrace promiſes whiche lift v aboue world make v beholde glorye whiche nowe inuiſible oftentymes wee cannot come poynte firſte brunte doctrine verye neceſſary v whereintoo myght wee fall wee take holde reſte whiche prepared v heauen wee ſhoulde fall intoo deſpayre blaſpheme god nothing bring v yeelde glorie confeſſe hee afflicteth v iuſtly rightly excepte wee feele preſente affliction auaylable ſaluation god ruleth ſuche wiſe ſerue v dicynes beleeue howe wee glorifie god howe wee ſtoupe vnder myghtie hande yeelde ſelues obediently sainct peter exhorteth v impoſſible nay cleane contrarywiſe wyll bee nothing v fretting gnaſſhing teeth befell vnto iob wyll befall vntoo v true iob mente nother woulde wee doo yet notwithſtanding wee bee blamewoorthie wee woulde pleade agaynſte god make ſelues rightuouſe haue good cauſe pray vnto god afflicteth v hee neuer ſuffer v forgo taſte ſauoure promiſes may alwayes hope hee bring miſeries ende yea ſuch ende wee ſhall haue cauſe prayſe good father hath procured welfare furthermore wee feele infirmitie bee ſuche wee bee maner dazeled affliction cannot mount vp reſt taryeth v aboue let v vnderſtande wee bee hye way blaſpheme god hee remedy yea althoughe wee meene make ſelues ryghtuouſe god yet notwithſtanding let v aſſure ſelues ayme alwayes marke wee fall grudging repining curſed blaſphemy behooueth v condemne paſsions ſo greued vexed wee knowe whiche ſide turne v let v conſider ſay affection boyle feruently therfore condemned holy ghoſte iob could well haue replyed therevnto haue ſayde neuer intent blaſpheme god magnifie rightuouſneſſe aboue yes hee doeth god rightuouſe wee mouth ſtopped condemne ſelues ſo wee alledge excuſes take leaue grudge agaynſte pleaſeth afflicte v ſorte ſoeuer ſo beaten downe confeſſe god doeth thing iuſtly certeyne would aduaunce rightuouſneſſe aboue one would ſpurne againſt ſunne ſith warned thereof let v learne ſayd preuent miſcheefe whenſoeuer afflicted let v fully perſuaded reſolued ſelues god knowes doeth although wee ſee reaſon therof furthermore muſte ſo troubled aduerſitie lyeth vpon v ſhoulde hope god deliuer v foraſmuch hee hath promiſed neuer fayle thoſe vvherefore let v ouerpaſſe trouble afore oure eye whiche hinder̄ v looking lette ſame ſerue comfort v ſo wee may ſay yet god haue pitie vpon v end therfore let v paſſe ſtill boldly go thorough courſe lo wee haue marke ſtreyne ſenſe ſuche appeareth eliu gathereth layeth forth ſaying thou hast ſayde ſhall boote mee haue ſinned ſhall profite mee thing wherein eliu vpbraydeth iob hee woulde make himſelfe rightuous god thought vnprofitable thing haue walked feare god haue abſteyned ſinne imagine god rightuouſneſſe become good aboliſhed god rightfulneſſe cōſiſteth onely man wrong alſo gouerning world equitie diſpoſing creature ſuch ſorte truſte ſhall diſappointed ſerue good conſcience ſure haue reward god ſhould forſake thoſe feare paſſe reward heauen ſurely ſhoulde ceaſſe rightuouſe according alſo apoſtle declareth epiſtle hebrewes god ſayeth vnrightuouſe ſhould remember affliction gyue releefe hee faythfull vvhen ſayeth god vnrightuouſe hee ſheweth ryghtuouſneſſe thing inſeparable beeing although thē exerciſe men many affliction world haue behaued themſelues ſtedfaſtly vocatiō yet muſt cōfort themſelues promis poynt well woorthy bee noted ſhall ſee many imagine god aſleepe heauen howbeeit godhead vayne imagination importeth thing haue ſpoken cō cerning gouernment ſouereyne dominion worlde namely like hath created thing ſo alſo man beaſt thing elſe hāde protection thing muſte brought good end ſakes although thing order heere bilowe yet meane whyle reſpect himſelfe nothing order although ſuffer thing otherwiſe diſpoſed wee woulde haue yea appoynt many confuzions alſo yet hee well skill ſet thing perfect ſtate agayne thus yee ſee thing belongeth vnto god peculiar beeing ſo lette v marke glorifie god yeeld deſerued prayſe rightuouſneſſe muſt beholde hande power thing doubt hath iuſt cauſe whatſoeuer doeth although wee knowe doeth lo effect haue beare minde furthermore perfecteſt men may ſometimes tempted ſay booteth thee haue ſinned according alledged yeſterday dauid entered ſame doubt ſayd haue loſte time clenzing handes loſte labour haue kept myſelfe filthineſſe infection dauid tempted heerewith faythfull nowe ſhaken ſuch fancies▪ ſpecially aduerſities oppreſſe v ſore reaſon infirmity deuill aſſayleth fayth thorough oure vnbeleefe ſo wee cannot bee ſore afrayde enter theſe preſent doubtes vvell done meane whyle vve muſte beate backe condemne onely condemne alſo abhorre ſaying wretched creature needes muſte thou full vanitie thou dareſt ſo ſet vp thy bryſtles againſt thy god outrage ye ſee howe behoueth v thruſte farre v wicked imagination wherwith diuel laboreth peruert v howbeit ſome time miſchiefe ſo greate ſufficiently ſtrengthened withſtand aſſaults according happened vnto iob fell length repining ſayde woulde man might thinke vpon mee ſorte ſpeaketh iob heatheniſhneſſe yea brutiſhneſſe ſay would graue ſhould feele miſeries thē hope faithfull becommeth threatenings god maketh wicked muſte bee fayne feele dreadfull hand ende iob become ſo brutiſhe▪ remembreth theſe thing behoueth v miſtruſt owne affectiōs may ſay perfecte man whiche like angell heauen recorde god owne mouth haue ſeene afore neuertheleſſe ſo ouerraught anguiſhe cannot conſider go graue medled together confuzedly god ſeparateth owne ſeruants reprobrate ſo ſoules cuſtody hee keepeth ſafetie iob ſo farre driuen hee coulde remember betide v true iob infidel deny reſurrection reiect doctrine euerlaſting life hee wanted preſente aduiſedneſſe bethinke time neede armour alwayes readineſſe like man ſhoulde perhaps bee taken vnwares ſo amazed coulde drawe ſworde ſhrinke backe ſtagger yea peraduenture receyue ſome blow ere coulde defend himſelfe euen like caſe iob true ſworde buckler taken ſo vnwares diuell ſome aduauntage inſomuche hee began ſhrinke haue ſhewed afore coulde lift vp minde heauen behold hope god giueth faithful seing ſo let v learne diſtruſte ourſelues knowe ſuch frailtie v wee ſhoulde bee borne downe neuer riſe vp agayne lorde pitie v reach v mighty hand end might cal vpon refer ourſelues wholly thus ye ſee wee haue marke effect vpon text byandby eliu addeth▪ anſwere thee thy cōpanions ſaying ſo hee ſheweth men ſtryue maner againſt god ſhal gaine nothing though neuer ſo great band trayne god able ynough beate backe one worde theyr confuſion iob companion ſpake alone mayntenaunce quarel eliuze intent ſay although thou haddeſt greate army thee conſpyred toogether accuze blaſpheme god one mouthe yet notwithſtanding myne anſwere ſhall bee ſufficient heere ſee howe ſtrong god truthe vayne fight againſt although wee fenced haue many partaker yet muſte god alwayes haue vpper hande ſo rightuouſneſſe ſhall continue vnappayred vvhen haue barked fill agaynſt wee ſhall bee able byte ſhall bee ſayde anone marke ſay haue remember ſtrayne therfore firſte let v learne lauiſh tongs god afflicteth v thing go minde let v bee impacient therefore affliction let v alwayes humble ſelues vnder acknowledging rightuouſe howſoeuer world go wee bee ſo bolde barret wyll greate confuzion ſhame yee ſee men ought brydle impriſon themſelues ende may neuer murmure agaynſte god blaſpheme furthermore though haue many partaker yet ſhall boote v god wyll ſuffer himſelfe bee ouercome neuer ſo greate multitude men ſhall bee vayne v aſſemble men owne retinue wee ſhall v bee put foyle together worlde made confederacie ſpyght god woulde paſſe woulde laugh ſcorne according ſayd ſeconde pſalme king earth haue conſulted together people haue ſtormed muche liſte hee aboue laugh ſcorne thus ye ſee ſecond point haue marke muſte thinke cace bee better haue many adherent partaker god condemne whole packe v furthermore wee ſee alſo parte wee haue god truth ſide muſt ſticke mainteyne giue v mouth wiſedome alſo power beate backe al enimies wee haue greate neede theſe dayes bee armed ſuch aſſurance ſee furiouſneſſe enemy goſpell ſet vp themſelues bycauſe wee handfull people greate multitude manner whole worlde agreeth practyze oure deathe beare themſelues hande goale goeth theyr ſide nothing triumphing amongeſte anye ſtroke bee ſtryken vvhat thing wee knew ſhewed v heere wit foraſmuch haue truth ſide one v may alwayes fight agaynſt hundred thouſande neede bee afrayde papiſtes come ſtoutly agaynſte v theyr ergoes although bee greate hoſte wee fewe none compariſon let abaſhe v ſaying anſwere thee thy companion written alonely perſone eliu holye ghoſte giueth v promis intent wee ſhoulde ſticke enter battell ſtande ſtoutly vttermoſt ſith wee knowe cace good god fighteth v bycauſe wee mainteyne quarrell therefore haue ſuche certeintie let v fight boldly againſt enimies muſte needes bee confounded ende thus yee ſee haue beare mind may put texte vre apply inſtruction ſpecially preſent tyme wee ſee whole worlde imbattayled agaynſt god multitude enimies ſo greate myght vtterlye diſcourage v oure lorde comfort v telling v wee haue wherewith anſwere though bee neuer ſo many gaynſayers ſo confederate toogether nowe let v come anſwere eliu maketh beholde sky ſayeth looke vp greateſt heauens hygher thou thou canneſt neuer reache ſeemeth bee rawe anſwere none reaſon whereby ſhewe ryghtuouſneſſe god yes ſaying bee applyed oughte ynough ſtoppe mouthes ſuch blaſpheme
