god beholding heauens hee leadeth v another conſideration whiche dooing well profiteth oure god dooing euill cannot hurte ſhall hee bee woorſe seeing ſo hee bee meaſured according vnto men hee reuengefull woulde ſay angrie man doeth wrong ledde affection lyke man lookes bee pleaſed think himſelfe beholding another man ſeruice god none ſuche wee muſte meaſure owne meateyearde imagine fleſhlineſſe sky vnder feete doo ſhewe well hee lyke v medled v haue part nature therefore wee ſee reaſon ſayde behold sky looke vp aboue thy head ſufficient beate downe thoſe dare lift vp themſelues againſt god nowe needefull laye followeth peecemele ende may bee better vnderſtoode vvhen eliu ſayeth thou doo good profite doth god receyue ſheweth therby god bounde vnto v marke firſte poynt ſecond affectioned men pleaſure doone mooued bicauſe paſsible god ſo nother ſhew frendſhip fauour ſo hee like vnto v touching firſt point namely god meanes bound vnto v true thing notwithſtāding ſee men grow proude yea euen without cauſe occaſion woulde make god beleue beholding although cā bring nothing draweth miſcheeuouſe tayle ſuperſtition vvhy papiſts labor ſo much day theſe ceremony gewgawes bycauſe thinke god receiueth ſome profit thē make many gewgawes haue babbled trotted place place thinke haue made fayre worke churchſtuffe well decked haue well trimmed waſhed puppet man made goodly banquette decked vp houſe beſtrawed ruſſhes thing papiſtes ſaye ſurmyze god delyghteth theſe nyce toyes hee taketh pleaſure muſte imagine wee bring thing vnto god cauſe ſayde ſixtenth pſalme lorde goodes cannot come thee howe honour thy ſainctes earth foraſmuch god receiue benefite v commendeth neyghbours vnto v good ſuch neceſsitie lyuing freendly vprightly among men indeuering imploye ſelues faythfully able help ſuccour god accepteth ſuche thing ſacrifices lette v remember doctrine ſayde cannot bring thing vnto god ſerueth abate pryde v intent might thinke god thing beholden v led vnto fooliſh ſuperſtitions gad vp downe doo many thing valewe though god tooke pleaſure wee bring nothing muſte alſo apply doctrine preſent intent eliu god like mortall men whiche moued touched bicauſe haue neede one anothers helpe cannot ſet lyght men force thus ye ſee cauſe wee bee mooued caryed fro muſte ſuche dotage enter oure heade concerning god hee behaueth himſelf maner nother good contrarywiſe alſo ſayd ſinne wee hurt true wee end god much v lyeth impeach rightuouſneſſe meanes ill delt withall therfore ſinne wee blamewoorthy leſſe wee hadde impeached maieſtie god vvee knowe rule rightuouſneſſe commaundeth v whē go contrary aſmuch would barre reygning plucke ſeate trample vnder feete al theſe thing men giltie yet cannot god either increaſed diminiſhed himſelf therfore let v marke well ſinning hurt god neuertheleſſe touching blaſpheme god true ſpew venime therby deface glory according ſayde name euill ſpoken glory diminiſhed acknowledge bee good rightuouſe wiſe confeſsing men ſo reygning diminiſhed howbeeit reſpect v reſpect himſelfe meane ſeaſon ſinning haue done neuer ſomuch cannot anoyaunce let beſt archer worlde ſhoote vp ſee hee ſhall hit skie vvhen wee haue practized poſsible wee come god meanes touche ſurely caſt vpward muſt fall downe vpon owne heades ſhoote man hit wound cannot hit god ſayd afore vve may well runne caſting ſtones may wel ſhoote bothe bowes gunnes yet ſhall god bee alwayes farre ynough dinte oure ſtrokes true haue already ſayde wee may well barke wee neuer byte vvhen men caſte vp theyr blowes lyght shall paſſe aboue sky ſhall fall backe vpon owne heades ſo men cannot auaunce themſelues agaynſte god cōfuziō thus ye ſee text well worthy noted vvherein eliu ſheweth amiſſe god hurt thervpon haue double inſtruction gather one god ſheweth ſingular infinite goodneſſe towards v pleaſeth accepte ſeruice although hee receyue profite ſame touche marke one ought vnderſtoode one word foraſmuch ſome ignorant perſons heere requiſite declare fully yee ſee god might reiect v without making accounte v haue ſayde lette world ſtreyne ſelfe muche yet ſhall wee bee able thing profit god yet notwithſtanding hee telleth v indeuer good walke commaundements dooings acceptable ſacrifices vntoo nowe ſingular comfort gyueth ſayeth accept doings although worthy eſtemed hande yet take good woorthe bind ſelfe beholding ſouereyne goodneſſe god doeth owne accord let v learne magnifie mercie god accepting work wheras deſerue ſide thing bounde thē alſo let ſerue incourage v well wee ſee god receyueth thing hande whiche nothing woorthe putteth poynts workes article bookes accounte acceptable thorough owne goodneſ • e good ſoothe ineſtimable goodneſſe god ſuch one asought rauiſhe v woonderment wee thinke vpon vvee ſee howe graciouſe ſheweth himſelfe towards v and▪ ſide wee muſte conſider poynt ſette downe neuer ſomuch euill burt god therefore lette v aſſure ourſelues god puniſhe v ſinnes reaſon ſpyght beareth vnto v deſireth bee reuenged man doeth offended man hath wrong doone ſo hee harmed owne perſon hindred good ſeeke bee reuenged god ſay moued ſuch conſiderations vvherefore doeth hee threaten v bycauſe haue v periſhe ſheweth fatherly regard hath welfare meane whyle puniſhe v indeede therin ſheweth iuſtice cace going lawe ſome priuate quarell v puniſheth v iuſte iudge according office nature afford ſeing god proceedeth manner haue conſider fatherly loue hee chaſtyzeth v meane hee draweth v backe waye damnation wherein wee therefore feele hande rough ſoeuer let v alwayes conſider ſheweth himſelfe rightuouſe vvhat done onely truſte comforte ſelues therewithall deſire haue pitie vpon v although wee haue offended yet hee may forbeare receyue v mercy heerewithall let v bee fully perſwaded reſolued god wyll beare ſuche ſtomake towardes v proude ſtately man doo foraſmuche hee fountayne goodneſſe mercy wee come vnto make v feele howe mercifull minded bee towardes v although chaſtice v yea euē roughly would yet make v perceyue doth welfare end ſhould periſhe brydling v ſo ſhorte humble v make v bow vnder mighty hand chaſticements nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone ende wee may finiſhe oure race greater patience oute miſeries calamity worlde therewithall learne ſo ſeeke perfection rightuouſneſſe wee may neuer bee wery learne ſchoole go forwarde waye ſaluation vntill wee come race ende whiche beeing bereft infirmity fleſhe may clothed euerlaſting glory may pleaſe graunte grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules miſerable bondage c cxxxvij sermon ſecond vpon xxxv chapter 8 thy vvickedneſſe toucheth man like thy ſelfe thy rightuouſneſſe sonne man 9 reaſon multitude oppreſſors men cry hovvle bycauſe mightineſſe mayſters 10 man ſayeth vvhere god hath faſhioned mee vvhiche gyueth v ſongs nyght 11 vvhich teacheth v beaſts inſtructeth v bird ayre concluſion declared yeſterday wee haue conſider eliu vttereth wordes miſdeedes touch men god likewiſe rightuouſneſſe end ſhould imagine god cholerick reuenge himſelf haue offended contrary part boūd vnto v ſeruice good thē let v thinke god like vnto v nother let v meaſure wit true abaced himſelf owne good doth ſpeake vnto v maner men yet muſt derogation highneſſe god deſpized bycauſe pleaſeth infinite goodneſſe yeelde rudeneſſe men nay contrarywiſe deſerueth magnified handes greate wrong iniurie transfigure bycauſe hee frameth himſelf ſlenderneſſe thinke angry bycauſe men haue prouoked thinke hee ought recompence men hee bounde ſay aboliſhing maieſtie number let v yeelde vnto men vnto whome belongeth behoueth v honour incomprehenſible hyghneſſe thus yee ſee wee haue gather vppon firſte verſe nowe remayneth ſee manner god rightuouſe gouerneth worlde equitie yet meane whyle thing order wicked haue theyr full ſcope oppreſſe pyll powle god diſſembleth maketh countenaunce prouide howe ment god hath guyding world diſpozeth thing ryghtly yet notwithſtanding men ſee ſo greate trouble outrageouſe iniquity withoute redreſſe eliu therefore comprehendeth thing ſheweth muſte woonder though god beeing ſo pacient let thing go amiſſe prouide ſo ſoone call vpon wee doo hartely god ſuffer men afflicted doeth iuſtly bycauſe returne prayer thankſgiuing ought neuertheleſſe behoueth v tary leiſure although hee delay iuſtice ſeeme ſende ſo ſoone ought come yet notwithſtanding muſt wayte paciently honour truſte although hee hidden v ſay firſt poynt ſet downe firſt eliu declareth men woorthie god ſhoulde ſuccoure neede bee oppreſſed ſo haue harme wrong done true crye oute ſtorme skill bewayle cace yet neuer flee vnto god man ſhall heare ſcreekes howling ſuch indure aduerſitie yet god heareth thē although office reskowe bee wrongfullye oppreſſed bycauſe haue eye vnto direct themſelues vnto make complaynte without order shoulde god leaue owne wilfulneſſe remedy know god doth chalenge title himſelf vaine wil ſuccour oppreſſed therevpon go directly vnto wee doo therefore cry purpoſe deſerue ſhaken hand ſhould ſhet eye regarde helpe v ſeeke written ſeeke ye ſhall finde go quite another way thus ye ſee point well woorthie bee noted ſtumblingblocke troubleth v ſore ſee god ſuffereth men languiſhe maner ſeemeth pitie miſeries come moſte extremitie thervpon conclude regardeth iniuries ſo farre withdrawen v hath care prouide neceſsities meane conſider deſerue wel bee deſtitute helpe bycauſe go right forth vnto truely euen daye confuſions ſo great horrible worlde cannot thinke vpon without ſhuddering looke vpō warres many place ye ſhall ſee whole countrey waſted poore folk know houſes burned goodes vtterly ſpoyled meanes whereof people ſuche anguiſhe bene better haue throtes cut firſte pine ſorte yet looke vntoo god man go ſtraunge countreys hee ſhall heare many complaintes hee ſhall neede go farre matter whereſoeuer bee tax impoſitions whereſoeuer men warre paſſe like floudes water man hee ſhall crie ſhall galled vnto harde bone doth worlde amende doeth come true humilitie ſeeke god ſay ala lord ſinnes thou handleſt v ſo roughly would behooue v thinke therevpon nothing v pryde diſdaine rebelliouſneſſe agaynſt thee therefore lorde thou haſt ſhewed thy ſelfe ſouerayne ſhew v alſo fauour may feele thee father ſuccoure v ende dooth worlde vſe ſuch ſpeeche ala farre men doo rather chafe vppon bitte meane whyle thinke vpon god rather record hee cannot beare ſuch deſpiſings grace like prooueth truth hee helpeth thoſe ſeeke ſue hee ſheweth thereby promiſing mercifull ſuche ſeeke diſappoynt theyr truſte hope like ratifieth truth ſheweth himſelfe faithfull truſtie helping ſuch call vpon alſo contrary parte ſuffereth thoſe rotte whiche ſeeke letteth waſt conſume length time ſo perceyued hee regardeth hath care neceſsitie wherin ſheweth himſelf rightuous hee puniſheth negligence rather pryde bicauſe deſpized grace offered ſo freely true alſo ſū dry time god doth firſt help thoſe ſeeke truth commeth paſſe continually happeneth yet iuſtlye wee muſte binde oure lyking althoughe god forſlowe ſuccour ſeruauntes euen call vppon theyr hearte yet dooth hee neuer forſake bee thing eliu treateth common ordinary maner ſcripture ſpeaketh goeth aboute doctrine ſhewe thing may bee ſeene moſte often yee ſee wee may conclude vvhen wee haue conſidered worlde wee ſhall finde ſuche e ſmitten vexed well ynoughe lamente theyr miſeries theyr cry vntoo god like beaſtly howling caſte oute ſhreekes intoo ayre reache theyr heartes vntoo god caſte theyr care ſorrowes vpon hee commaundeth v cauſe hee ſheweth himſelfe fauourable vnto v vvee muſte blame crueltie vnrightuouſneſſe nother muſte wee imagine hee doeth men wrong wee ſee woorthy puniſhmente receyue wage vnbeleefe bicauſe reſted vpon promiſes gyuen mooued themſelues reſorte vnto god ought haue doone ſayd men call vpon god per • duēture ſome prayer bee made eliu ſheweth nothing ſay god made mee giueth ſongs night inſtructeth v beaſts teacheth v thā foules • yr • ▪ touched euen nowe ſerueth anſwere might alledged wretched men call vpon god afflicted yea ſayeth eliu faynedly therefore vayne inaſmuche prayer moſte parte worlde maketh bypocriſie therfore god heareth thus reaſon eliu ſetteth downe go vntoo god maker hath faſhioned • comforteth men gyueth thē ſo many benefites ought magnifie mercie miſerie ſoeuer indure acknowledge god ſuche one hee ſheweth himſelfe towards v eſteeme gracious gift haue receyued hande ſay wee come thus minded nothing ſeyning falſhood v therfore muſte maruell though ſhette gate agaynſt v make countenaunce heare requeſts behold text right woorthy bee marked ye ſhall ſee theſe dayes papiſts make proceſſions god layeth hand vpon bee plague famine aduerſitie true turne vnto god ſo doo paynim well doo call vpon true rightmeening heart ala far wyde ceremony proofe heereof let v marke well men cannot ſeeke god rightlye excepte know ſuch one ſhould feele experience firſt al whē call vpon god muſt remember hee oure maker wee hand let v examine thoſe make countenaunce praying man ſerche hearte ſhall hee finde haue skill ſay ſeeing god hath faſhioned mee hande belongeth rule mee lyfe prouyde neceſsities holde therefore behoueth mee ſuffer ſelfe bee gouerned hande according pleaſure shall man finde one among hundred thus minded ſpeaketh true hearte yeelde honour god maker confeſſe well ynough theyr mouth ye • ſay wee made hee hath gyuen v life meane whyle theyr confeſsing▪ yet fully reſolued cleane contrary prayer woorthie beare name men ſo brutiſheas acknowledge god ſuche one hee ſheweth himſelfe towardes howbeeit matter conſiſteth onely acknowledging god bee maker wee muſte alſo therewithall eſteeme gracious giftes whiche hee ready gyue v according ſayd expreſſely text giueth ſongs nyght men expounde ſaying ſorte namely byrdes doo cheare v theyr ſinging ſame oughte bee imputed god goodneſſe men ſhewe theyr vnthankefulneſſe acknowledging it▪ ſome take god doeth comforte v making ſtarres ſhine gyueth v occaſion ſet forth goodneſſe although sun downe darkneſſe ouerſpreade v yet doeth god lighten v candels ſhould ſay maieſtie quenched altogither hidden v ſuch expoſitions much ſtreyned therefore wee muſte take ſimply god gyueth song euen time men aſleepe night ſeemeth make al thing dead vvhen ſunne thing whiſt ſtill ſeemeth kynd death god holdeth v ſhet vp graue eliu ſpoken song daye time beene ſo great magnifying god grace day time men followe worke doth cheerefulneſſe ſhew ſelfe wit awake therefore bin ſo excellent thing haue ſaid god giueth ſongs day time whē aſsigneth night ſingular goodneſſe god wee ſort deade ſpirits oppreſſed liuelineſſe v yet notwithſtanding lord doth ſtill giue v ſongs whē men wake night haue wherof reioyce feeling god hath protection ought conſider continue without ſleepe▪ meane god watcheth therefore ought reioyce behalf ſay ala lord cannot call vpon thee ſo long aſleepe behold heere blocke timberlog yet thou keepeſt mee meane breathe throughe thy goodneſſe yea ſleeping doeth ſo feede refreſhe mee gather newe ſtrength without feeling men think vpon theſe thing haue cauſe glad ſay ala god thou ſheweſt thy ſelf father towards euē ſeeke thee yea haue ſenſe like dead creature ſeing ſo much likely thou wilt neerer mee commit ſelf vnto thee cal vpon thee howſoener cace ſtand whither ſleepe whither wake ſhall alwayes thy hande ſafekeeping vvhen men haue ſuche thoughtes ſinging vnto god ſee wherat eliu ameth namely oftentimes whiche afflicted haue truthe pretende pray vnto god would become v gather togither god benefites call mynd good hath done v without end ceaſſing intent ſame might cheere v vp ſo ſlothfull pitie ſee yea wee fall diſputing howe may go vnto god meane come whither regarde v yee ſee thing haue cheere vp mind greate number benefit hath beſtowed vpon v ceaſſeth deal vnto v ſtill day day firſt ſerueth confirme v ſuche wiſe wee muſt doubt come vnto vpon truſt heare v alſo make v come thankſgiuing wheras haue taſted goodneſſe benefites haue receyued hand grudge repine againſt therefore haue well weyed thing tolde v heere doubt ſhall howe much bounde vnto haue throughly ••• ir way acknowledging benefit god thou giue 〈…〉 ed cleane contrarie nough rauiſhe 〈…〉 knowledge god maker fore ſeeing thou haſt 〈…〉 nefits haue receyued wardes mee ought 〈…〉 ſpecially ſeing acknowname thou afflicte mee b 〈…〉 image forget god benefite 〈…〉 nge though god ſuffer foote therefore call vpiſeries perearneſtly thing whiche wee 〈…〉 worthy pon ſtreyne eliu ſpeaketh 〈…〉 texte god neuer ceaſſeth v good ſo mu • e time whiche ſeemeth moſt deade •• h ewould ſay euen god ſelfe hidden ſo ſeemeth bee mynded continue fauoure • towards v ceaſſeth giue v occaſion ſtill▪ magnifie goodneſſe seeing ſo ought touched another manner deſirouſneſſe come vnto eliu addeth vniuerſall benefit god hath beſtowed vpon men true euerie man ought owne behalfe mynde benefit god according neuer one v excedingly bound vnto god great benefit hath done vnto deſire know god good liberall neede looke hath done men indifferently enter ſelfe conſider whole courſe life marke benefites haue felt hande god ſhall rauiſhed aboue worlde ſay lorde ſhould go comprehend thy goodneſſe ſo deepe gulfe neuer able bring paſſe take little portion token recordes thou haſt giuen mee beholde wit end ſhould bring lo howe behoueth euerie man owne behalfe marke priuate benefites hee hath receyued god yet notwithſtanding wee thinke onely vpon thing common general amongſt al mankynde ſame ought bee ynought cauſe v magnifie god yea euen ſuche wiſe wee come pray deliuer v affliction wee ought therewith reioyce yeelde prayſe ſhewing himſelfe ſo good father towardes v doe therein wee ſhewe owne vnthankfull malicious minde perceiue apparant nothing hypocriſie v effect thing eliu ment ſay word god teacheth v beaſtes giueth v vnderſtanding foules ayer maketh compariſon betweene men beaſtes heauen earth coulde ſpeake certaine ſhould needes prayſe god though haue vnderſtanding aduaunced dignitie great honour god hathe done worke handes creature god haue inhonored heauen earth ſenſeleſſe creature hee hath voutſafed create haue inhonored beaſts though haue made thē voyd reaſon hath done man hath giuen ſuch vnderſtanding cauſe eliu doth compare v beaſts wherof long god made 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 v aſſes horſes nobleſt excellenteſt man vpon earth ſay made ſelfe made ſuch one god could well haue made dog ſwyne made mā muſt wee ſeeke grounde ſelues god made v reaſonable creature muſt cōmende goodneſſe towardes v ſpecially ſeeing hee hathe ſo greatly honoured v onely make v number creature alſo aduance v aboue brute beaſtes giuing v wit reaſon hee hath doone earthly creature thing told v firſt chapter sainct iohn namely thing haue life god ſame life hath euermore bin incloſed eternall word howbeit one life whiche light life ſerueth men vvhereas ſayde life men ſay light iohn ſheweth haue brutiſh mouing eate drinke haue diſcretion god giueth v vnderſtaning know good euill attaine euen euerlaſting life perceiue one onely god ought honour father much thē god doth ſo inlighten men ſee ſelues bound farre greater ſtraighter bond ſimply made v creature god hath created v hande yet behoued v giue thankes ſeeing hath pleaſed make difference betweene v brute beaſtes giue v ſo noble excellēt life wee ſee may well ſay lord yet notwithſtanding hath pleaſed thee ſet v nū ber thy child giue v thy marke whence commeth vnto v find thing ſelues ſay wee haue moued thee heerevnto thou werte led vnto worthyneſſe proceedeth thine owne free goodneſſe nowe wee ſee conteyned text namely wee haue cauſe ynough praiſe god though thing generall benefite extendeth mankind hath giuen v wit reaſon aboue brute beaſts neuertheleſſe true reaſon god gaue firſt man verie ſore corrupted nowe nature ſo peruerted cannot iudge thing god blinde wretch nothing vanitie v moreouer luſtes ſo carie v away ſtay modeſtie v ſo much worſe wee bee compared brute beaſtes bee found ſoundneſſe horſe oxe mā horſe hauing reaſon doeth notwithſtanding retaine giuen man ſo ſotted reſon turned maliciouſneſſe ſtead honoring god benefit hath receiued become proud vtterly rebellious againſt furthermore wee ſee reaſon thinke ourſelues haue vtter beaſtlyneſſe come thinke vpon god ſee men intangled ſuperſtitions vvhat men conceiue god vtter vanitie scripture ſheweth men bee ſo dazeled thinke vpon god forge ſuche heape ſuperſtitions woulde ſerue reaſon vnderſtanding eliu magnifieth ſo much true haue ſayde light haue nature turned darkneſſe reaſon ſinne corruption haue drawne oure father adam howbeit looke euill ſinfull muſt wee impute owne fault according alſo nature wee haue receyued eue oure firſte creation whereas wee bee ſo inclyned confuſion truſt owne wit wee ſay commeth firſt creation ſaye wee muſt impute vnto god god created v image image marred ſinne adam ſo behoueth men acknowledge owne faulte yeelde ſelues giltie god diſfiguring oure ſelues turning light darkeneſſe waye heere yet one poynte marke midſt ignorance errour ſuperſtitions lord doth hold v ſtill conuicted bounde vnto ineſtimable bonde aduaunceth v aboue brute beaſtes leauing v ſome diſcretion imprinted heartes diſcerne good euill sainct iohn meeneth adding forealledged texte light ſhineth darkeneſſe hee ſhould ſay althoughe ſinne haue ſo peruerted mennes vnderſtanding vtterly defaced nature yet notwithſtanding god doth ſtill inlighten ſuch wiſe man may perceyue ſome print firſte creation although haue thing giuen beginning oure father adam ſcarſely holde little portion yet ought well perceyue god hath giuen v ineſtimable benefite hathe pleaſed make v men ſeparate v ſort brute beaſtes see heere howe greateſt leaſt man haue occaſion murmure againſt god muſt alwayes come poynt inquire wee vvhat haue giuen vnto god vvhat wee alledge vnto hee ſhoulde bee bounde vnto v nothing contrarywiſe behoueth v yeelde vnto muche hee created v owne image made v menne therein wee exceedingly bounde vnto therewithall let v marke nowe god put difference betweene man man haue cauſe grudge againſt wee ſee theſe fantaſticall perſons man ſpeake god election tel choſeth vnto ſaluation whō thinketh good kicke winch againſt ſaying howe ſo vvere reaſon god ſhould hate creature ſo vvere indifferent dealing yea ſhoulde ſay god tyed men authoritie ouer seeing god choyce power make v brute beaſts yet hath printed image v giuen v far higher dignitie thē ſhould grudge againſt put difference betweene man man owne ſecrete ordinaunce without making v knowe cauſe ſhewing goodneſſe ſeing hath made man beaſt wheras might haue done doe loue nature haue cauſe grudge againſt ſee ſuch rayle god election wit ſpecially ſeeing behoued returne matter ſhewed v namely known euen vnto paynim appeareth euen among painims ſome haue vſed manner prayſing god therefore ſuche phantaſticall heades muſt ſet ſchole infidel worthie haue maliciouſneſſe matched ſuch pryde againſt god reproued holy ſcripture conſideration benefit god hath beſtowed generally vpon al mankinde ought prouoke v magnifie haue ſo much greater occaſion cal vpon thankeſgiuing benefites haue receiued hath giuen v much ſay hath reformed image v offered v worde ſhewed ſelfe familiarly vnto v therefore heere muſt proceede degree firſte muſt vnderſtande ſeeing god hath inhonored v making v creature wee alreadie bounde vnto thoughe none cauſe hee hath preferred v brute beaſts yea euen owne meere goodneſſe without finding cauſe v yet another thing wherein hath ſhewed ſelfe louing come ſeeke ſuch knowledge muſt make way v opē v gate beholde come god manner doe ſeeke hath created alſo hath vttered fatherly loue towardes created owne image likeneſſe vvhat cauſe hath aduaunced aboue brute beaſtes ſufficient matter occaſion boldneſſe come vnto furthermore ſcourged hande foreſayde reaſon ynough aſſuage oure miſeries howe greeuous ſo euer ſeeme wit ſeeing wee haue receyued benefites god hande ought wee ſuffer oure ſelues chaſticed hee liſt vſe roughneſſe towardes v thus sugar may terme ſeazon ſorowes withall call god benefit remembrance time affliction acknowledging ſaying verie well mortall creature god hath put difference betwene brute beaſtes howebeit moreouer haue bene baptized name lorde ieſus chriſte ſecond marke hath ſet vpon ſhew minded keepe ſtocke howbeit much haue defaced baptime haue bin faithleſſe wretch yet beholde god hath drawne back againe himſelfe hath inlightned midſt thicke darkneſſe wherein verely plunged bottome hell god hath reached hand ieſus chriſt dayſunne rightuouſneſſe doeth ſo inlighten mee beholding face doctrine goſpell ſee gate paradyſe opened vnto mee seeing lorde cheereth v ſuche wiſe haue wee good cauſe magnifie humble oure ſelues nowe let v ſee howe many bee founde doe ſo true haue declared alreadie ſuche ouerpreſſed miſeries calamity crie vnto god ſort haue throughly conſidered aforehande howe much bounde vnto haue made way acknowledging benefit haue receyued cleane contrarie foraſmuch men acknowledge god maker call mynde benefit haue receyued without ceaſsing ſpecially ſeing acknowledge hath created image wee muſt thinke ſtraunge though god ſuffer v pyne wither away miſeries perceyue helpe hande wee worthy thus yee ſee haue marke texte nowe muſt wee doe contrarie parte much holie ghoſt doth heere mouth eliu reproue men frowardneſſe tell god comfort deliuer aduerſities bycauſe ſeeke truth let v bee well aduiſed make god former benefites ſheelde ſet againſt aduerſities oppreſſe v ſaying true affliction ſo bitter thou looke inoughe tumble thee diſpaire hath thy god ſhewed himſelf father towardes thee ſo many way thou muſt needes feele fauor goodneſſe behoueth thee ſhet vp thy ſenſes ſuffer thy affection debate ouermuch beholde ſay wherevnto behoueth v come furthermore haue well bethought v god gracious gift let ſerue v double vſe firſt muſt bee certifie v ſhal diſappoynted praying ſeing god hath alreadie ſhewed himſelf beneficiall towards borne continued ſame time life goodneſſe infinite thing doubt heare come cal vpon ye ſee howe ought take god benefit perſuade ſelues loſt time ſeking vnto againe point wee muſt arme ſelues pacience therefore wee thinke ſo vpon god benefit let ſame ſerue comfort v time trouble let v bee ſo malicious grudge againſt rather let v thinke thus seeing god hath created reaſon ſhould haue right ouer ſhould gouerne pleaſure come referre ſelues ſort vnto god goodneſſe ſhall ceaſſe ſubmit ourſelues vnto affliction hee layeth vpon v haue receiued benefites hand therfore muſt nowe preſume plucke head yoke thus yee ſee two thinges wherevnto behooueth v apply knowledge god benefit call vpon truth nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone therewithall open eye may ſo dulheaded forget deſpyze benefites maye magnifie according worthineſſe thinke vpon ſuch wiſe may prouoked ſerue honour walke aduiſedly according good take ſuche example chaſticementes hee ſendeth oure neighboures ſame may ſerue v correction ſhal pleaſe chaſtice v oure owne perſons make v feele ſtrokes hande wee haue neede turne furtherance oure ſaluation ſo paſsing trouble worlde hee may ſtrengthen v continually power vntill hee receiue v euerlaſting reſt whiche hee hath prepared v kingdome may pleaſe graunt grace v c cxxxviij sermon third vpon xxxv chapter 12 ſhall crie god vvill heare bycauſe pryde vvicked 13 surely vanitie god heareth nother doth almightie regarde 14 thou haſt ſaide hee ſeeth thee iudgement vvayt 15 novve viſiting anger nothing viſiting wrath nother puniſheth hee greatly anger 16 iob hath opened mouth vaine multiplyed vvords vvithout vnderſtanding much firſt ſentence haue nowe rehearſed ought ioyned matter handeled yeſterday behoueth v beare mynde hath bin declared whiche god heareth theſe trouble ſheweth blame muſte wited vpon ſelues bycauſe come right pure heart according eliu hath declared come ſeeke god muſt conſider benefites gracious giftes haue receiued hand elſe truſt vvhat foundation faith free promiſes god hath giuē v yet experience haue goodneſſe confirmation thing knowe word ſo haue conceiued taſt benefites come vnto hypocriſie moreouer know much bounde vnto god impoſsible wee ſhould bee pacient obey continue quiet without murmuring againſt therefore eliu addeth nowe ſhall crie ſhould ſay verie well true men ſhall crie vnto god troubled plight come ſo minded ought nothing leſſe thinke benefit haue receiued hand nother doe profite ſelues ſettle truſt vpon men ſhal crie anguiſh ſhall come god openneſſe hart therfore god heare muſt blame owne ſinnes ſay god hath forgotten worlde doth dutie aſleepe therefore men ſeeke god truth hee neere hande ſone ſhewe ſelfe ſuccor ſo long houle like wilde beaſts looke right forth marke whiche ought ayme cry ſhall purpoſe let v mark well day god heare v leaſtwiſe make v feele helpe thoughe wee ſtorme neuer ſomuch cry ſtand vpon ſure grounde cheefe poynt knowe ſuch one hee ſheweth himſelf namely father ſauiour reſt vpon goodneſſe euen calling remembraunce record haue erſt felt therof end ſame may giue v courage ſeeke wee ought doubt wee ſhall ſoone finde yea ſhall neede make long windlaſſes come v ſo ſee prayer conſiſteth ceremony rightneſſe hearte afore god yea onely feeling miſeries muſt make v deſire remedie alſo wee muſte throughe fayth deſire ſhewe ſelfe oure father ſauiour fayth beeing grounded vpon promiſes muſte alſo bee confirmed good token giueth v ſhall haue found experience good mercifull muſt able apply ſame oure owne inſtruction wee may bee ryghtly fenced furthermore requiring god mercifull vnto v muſt bring ſacrifice prayſe benefites wherewith hath bound v vnto alreadie nowe eliu hath ſayde ſo addeth ſuch toke hold god prouidēce ſayde tuſhe vanitie god heareth nother doth almightie regarde obiection made perſon vnbeleeuers although bee tolde god doeth iuſtly leaue men weltring owne wretchedneſſe bicauſe come fayth obedience yet notwithſtanding cannot conceiue reaſon imagin fooliſhly god hereth ſeemeth let world goe hauocke thing ruled beneth fortune ye ſee faithleſſe brutiſh ſuddeine conceit catch hold thing ſhewed eies without diſcerning though loth conſider reaſon cōmeth next hand would ſay ſee yonder mā hath done ſuch thing yea thou muſt ſeeke vnderſtand reaſon marie inquiſitiue wilfull bereuing ſelues wit reaſon ſhetting eye againſt light euen much vnbeleeuers ſee god heareth thoſe crye therevpon fall ſtorming yea accuſing god therefore maruell thoughe god make ſuccour fauour felt ſuche doe nothing chafe aduerſities yeelde obedience ne ſeke vnto ſuch mind ought god hath iuſt cauſe let mē periſh maner bicauſe calleth thē come way ought mā tel faithleſſe theſe thing ſhet eye think vpon much ſaid prouidence god al regard v vtter burying yet neuertheleſſe thing whereto fleſhely reaſon carieth v reſtreined brydle lowlyneſſe modeſtie deeme god workes iudgements according worde ſheweth v reherſed eliu perſon vnbeleuers nought holy ghoſt hath ſet downe ſuch blaſphemie ende euerie v ſhould bethink himſelf vve haue ſeede ſuch frowardneſſe nature euerie brayde caried away rage chafing againſt god conclude doth dutie much ſtomack ful much pryde paſſe bound ſo far ouerthrow reaſon ſet afore v teach v humble ſelues come iudge god doings ordinance vvherefore let v giue bridle nature heare god ſpeak▪ way well reaſons hee bringeth aboue thing let v marke wel eliu ioyneth making ſaid obiection addeth although thou ſayeſt god ſeeth iudgement looke thou eliu remedieth ſaid frowardneſſe hath bin diſcouered end ſhould bethink v euill v giue ouer true theſe word craſed reaſon ſhortneſſe bycauſe ſet thus behold thou ſayest elſe albeit thou ſay ſhall ſee ſaying may bee taken alſo perſon iob thoughe eliu vpbrayded haue thought thus thou ſhalt ſee god nother ſhalt thou know well conſidered ſentence muſt knitte together therewithall muſte alſo bee diſtinguiſhed thus although thou ſay ſhall ſee hereby eliu ſignifieth men aduaunce themſelues muche ought conſider rudeneſſe ſmall capacitie ſee god ſay ſerch bottome true muſt alwayes looke vnto god howbeit muſt firſt beſeech giue v eye furthermore alſo muſt behold glaſſe offereth v ſay word work muſt walke ſuch ſobrietie muſt deſirous ſeke lawfull giueth v leaue doe one maner ſeeing god good holie behold ſo farre forth pleaſeth ſhewe ſelfe vnto v diſtruſt owne vnderſtanding ſo wee deſire bee inlighten holie ſpirite ouercurious preſumptuous knowe hee permitteth wee looke god face ſuffer thing bee hidden v enter incomprehenſible determination euen verie bottome theſe depthes intollerable pryde men vtterly confound ſelues let v learne meane wee muſt holde ſee god vve muſt goe ouermuch haſt muſt ſober knowing ſmall meaſure vnderſtanding infinite highneſſe god maieſtie furthermore ſeeing hee hath declared ſelf vnto v ſo farre forth knoweth meete conuenifor welfare let v holde v content knowledge hath giuen v fall raunging heere marke howe eliu ſayeth nowe vnto iob although thou ſay ſhall ſee ſayd▪ thou art ouerhaſtie ſpeake thou thruſteſt thy ſelfe thou ſhouldeſt conſider thou arte conſider god caſt downe thyne eye forget pryde thee afterward addeth iudgement face iudge thou ſaying may ſet downe two wayes take iudge thou exhortation humilitie repentaunce eliu ſhuld ſay wretched man ſee thou lifteſt vp thy ſelf againſt god maketh thee ſo bicauſe thou iudgeſt thy ſelfe therefore enter intoo thy ſelfe looke vpon thyne owne wretchedneſſe thy pryde bee plucked downe thus yee ſee remedie giuen v heere holie ghoſt reproue v wee runne aſtray haue vnbeleefe conceyued wicked haſtie imagination againſte god wee bee brought right way muſt goe downe owne ſelues examine oure owne ignorance ſinfulneſſe ſhall wee bee aſhamed forget wandering conceytes wherewith caryed fro▪ lo ſenſe doctrine wee ought gather ſaying take bee ſet downe iudge thou verie true meening texte iudgement god therefore eliu concludeth men ſhould loke counterviewe betweene face god oure ſight eliu ſhoulde ſay god ceaſſeth bee rightuous although appeare vnto v knowe god gouerneth worlde ordereth thinges vprightly wee muſt meaſure thing perceyue god iudgement high v wee reach vnto firſte brayde therefore let v marke well god ſeeth good rightful wheras moſt commonly blind vvhat done nothing elſe euen tarie according faythfull man muſt fed hope hee may yeelde himſelfe peaceable obedient vnto god wee knowe behoueth v hope thing viſible v nowe haue wee naturall ſenſe texte remayneth wee apply ſame oure owne inſtruction although thou ſay thou ſhalte ſee ſheweth v muſt haue tong libertie ſhoot forth whatſoeuer thinke concerning god muſt bridle tongs hold thoughtes priſoners aſſuring ſelues god intendeth keepe v humilitie concealing reaſon workes v therefore let thoſe condemned ſpirite god take heede ruſhe farre marke one poyet ought well conſidered wee bee able ſee god howbeit haue ſaid alreadie true god graunteth v grace priuiledge ſhewe ſelfe vntoo v howbeit ſo farre foorth hee knoweth bee expedient v god beeing inuiſible ſelfe ſheweth ſelfe glaſſe ſo farre conuenient v wit worde workes yet muſt wee inquiſitiue alſo cauſe ſendeth v alwayes meane hath hilde allure v knowe knoweth ouerboldneſſe alſo fickleneſſe wit wee ſo vnconſtant pitie ſee truely two great vice men ſo ouerhardie alſo haue ſo diſordered luſtes otherſide ignorance rather beaſtlineſſe moreouer alſo frowardneſſe therefore haue neede bee reſtrayned meane god hath giuen v bee contented thing cōteyned holy ſcripture aſſuring oure ſelues wee ſhall bee danger ſtraying wee followe way without ſtepping conſider god workes iudge owne fancie liking onely hearing telleth v worde ſuffering ſelues taught mouth ſo wee deſire haue none cunning furthermore muche ſayde lorde ieſus chriſte liuely image wherein beholde whatſoeuer good conuenient v know let v reſt according alſo ſayd another place al treaſures wiſdome knowledge layde vp let v marke well blinde wretch wil inquire god owne wit ſhall hidden v ſhall neuer come neere much leſſe able come therfore muſt learne condemne ſelues vtterly confeſsing nothing v meere brutiſhneſſe haue wee acknowledged let v praye god inlighten v holie ſpirite may full preſumptuouſneſſe pryde ſay able ſeke thē ſelf let v kepe ſelues ſuch diueliſh preſumption let v hū ble oure ſelues god praying inlighten v herewithall alſo ſeeing hath ordeined word meane ſhewe ſelfe vnto v let v bee tyed attempt paſſe beyond thus much concerning firſt poynt ſhewed v heere nowe let v come ſayde iudgement face must wayte haue touched alreadie muſt eſteeme god iudgementes eyeſight ſhort ſo dimme pitifull vvhat let v vnderſtande god dwelling vnapprochable light scripture ſayeth reſerueth himſelfe knowledge thing profound v therfore let v conclude god rightuous although wee ſee whenſoeuer finde doings ſtraunge offended muſt thinke thus wretched creature thou haſt eye deede dimme yea ſtarke blinde althoughe thy god inlighten thee yea euen ſome good portion yet wil ſtill reſtraine thee end thou maiſt honour confeſſe rightuous seeing thy wit vnderſtanding ſo weake thing thou wouldeſt comprehende infinite wiſedome god therfore refer thing vnto thy god paſſe thine vnderſtanding thou ſeeſt reaſon behalf vntil thou beare wel mind fully beleue leſſon thy hart iudgement face god marke ſay behoueth v correct ouerboldneſſe v end may cōfeſſe although might ſeeme haue cauſe enter diſputation againſt god yet notwithſtanding ſeeth thing hid v compariſon contrarie thing ſpake euen whereas ſayd iudgement god ſight alſo declared vnto v ſight eliu ſhould ſay god ſeeth men god knoweth man ignorant vvil thē reſerue vnto god due honor vve muſt rid ourſelues vaine preſumption wherein wee puffed vp nature would wiſe alwayes tickled diueliſhe luſt deſirouſneſſe inquire thing belong vnto v therefore let v contented glorify god yelding vnto namely wiſdome ſurmounteth al vnderſtāding capacitie impoſsible ſhuld done without hope ſtay holdeth v obeying god thing nouriſheth v modeſtie lowlineſſe dout hoped thing ſhuld go better god would giue ſuch end cannot perceiue certein mind ſhould neuer quiet let v marke giue god glorie belongeth vnto confeſsing rightuous behoueth v hopeful although thing go amiſſe ſo broile ſemeth heauen earth ſhould cō founded togither yet muſt reſt vpon promiſes hath giuen v aſmuch turneth darkneſſe light hath ſhewed creation world knoweth draw good euil wil ſo diſpoſe thing ſeemed vtterly order ſhall perceiued ende hath wonderfull wiſdome neuertheleſſe firſt brunt therfore good doctrin warning namely muſt iudge thing firſt ſight haſtie raſh iudgement hope muſt go v lampe ſhewe v way oyle lampe ſay inlightned ſticking god promiſes wait paciently til god worke according hath ſpokē mouth vntil hand vtter ſelf conuenient time ſhall learne modeſt glorify confeſsing rightuous doings notwithſtanding troubled heere ſeeme midſt many gulfes true ſtudie chriſtians furthermore marke nowe adayes ſo eaſily caried rather vtterly driuen way bicauſe wee haue ſettledneſſe toſſed vnquietneſſe yea euē boyling vnquietneſſe ſo would haue god make haſt according fancie thing imagined minde ſeemeth v thing forlorn paſt recouerie bicauſe vnderſtand ſo long think vpō ſelues cauſeth v pacience obedience founde v therefore ſo much doth ſtād v hād put doctrin vre whē ſee al thing hurlyburly ſo god ſeemeth haue ſhet eye haue turned back vpon v let v vnderſtand bycauſe ſinne yet neuertheleſſe let ſame confyrme oure fayth let v bee quiet aſſuring ſelues god office inioyne v ſilence vntill conuenient time bee come yea vntill hee knowe bee conuenient v binde ſtake ſay thing muſt done manner thing muſt learne repoſe ourſelues god ſhall pryde bee beaten downe ſo ſhall thinke god doings bee good ryghtfull iuſt although ſeeme ſtraunge v firſt ſight thus yee ſee haue marke texte nowe eliu addeth god preſent viſiting puniſhing anger hee knoweth multitude greatly truely text ſomwhat hard playne meening effecte although god nowe ſhewe himſelf rough ſharpe yet notwithſtanding knew dreadful terrible wrath would ſay none thing wee ſee world hee examine thing vttermost hee ſearcheth thing deepe doth paſſe ouer glaunce men terme heereby eliu ment ſhew afflicted vttermoſte ſo god ſeemeth thunder ſuche wiſe vpon v would ouerwhelme v behoueth v conſider wrath hee would vtter full able deſtroy ſome one man alſo hundred thouſand world yea conſume vtterly bring nothing yee ſee whervnto brought holie ghoſt furthermore verie profitable admoniſhment aſſuage affliction god ſendeth v cauſeth v think tormented meaſure bicauſe ſeeming god could worſſe offend god part cōceiue ſuche opinion according haue ſhewed let v learne cōſider god wrath ſay dreadfull although hee ſhewe himſelf rough towards v yet notwithſtanding let v aſſure ſelues hundred part whiche ſhould feel would execute ſuch rigor vpon v haue deſerued seing thē may know god wrath ſuche able one minute houre deſtroy hundred thouſand world neither mē earth angel heauē ſhould able abide heauen earth al elſe beſides ſhuld melted away like ſnow yea brought vtterly nothing ought humble ourſelues notwithſtanding god deale ſharply v ſend v rough puniſhmēts much thē ought ſtil pacient ſeing god ſpareth v bereth v good ſooth haue cauſe giue thankes ſeeing vttereth wrath againſt v wee worthie ſufficient matter giue v heart cheere v vp throughly midſt affliction wee conſider ſay ſelues true good ouerwhelmed ſeemeth god ſhall vtterly periſh yet rigor nothing ſo great vpon might feele reſpect feebleneſſe muche god beareth truſt ceaſſe ſeeke hee giueth ſtill ſome ſigne may haue entrance come vnto behold ſay howe haue cauſe rather bliſſe god affliction wee knowe beareth v therewithall alſo taught truſt ſeing openeth v gate end might ſtill aske forgiueneſſe oure ſinnes beſeech haue mercie vpon v therfore let v wey well theſe word eliu ſayth god preſent puniſhing nothing reſpect wrath wherefore muſt ſay miſerie great indure certaine man haue eye god wrath compare indured world ſhall finde verie deede bee layde vpon v heere nothing ſeeing nothing god ſearcheth v extremitie paſſeth ouer v lightly would ſay glauncingly ſo maketh countenance trie v examineth v ſtraightly bycauſe wee bee able beare let v learne reſtreyne murmuring oure fleſhe prouoke v impaciencie ouermuch giuen vntoo let remedie ſerue correct vice howe nowe wretched creature intendeſt thou doe vvilt thou ſpight thy god thou ſeeſt hee beareth ſtill thee thou haſte prouoked wrath ſo ſore thou mighteſt well deſerue rooted world hundred time thou art worthy bee drowned deepe hell yet thou ſeeſt maketh ſunne ſhine vpon thee hee nouriſheth thee breade maynteyneth thee preſente lyfe owne charge thou arte worthie bee number workes hath created yet giueth thee reſpite ſtill returne vnto vvhen thinke vpon theſe thing wee haue wherewith comfort ſelues might much cumbred impaciencie thus effecte yee ſee doctrine wee haue gather texte heerewithall let v marke although lord nowe viſit v wrath examine thing vttermoſt muſt thervpon fall ſleepe great day come wherin nothing ſhall forgotten nowe god winketh thing puniſheth wicked take libertie thoughe ſcaped iudges hande ſhould neuer yeelde account ſhall paye deare time ſhall ſo abuſe pacience woulde allure vnto goodneſſe giuing reſpite amende seing wicked ſo mocke god horrible vengeance muſt needes fall vpon heade ende ſhall great day furthermore god ſpare v let v ceaſſe bee watchfull hee chaſtice v beate v roddes let v alwayes conſider howe terrible wrath therevpon conclude hee doth ſummon v ende wee ſhould preuent laſt iudgement therefore let v alwayes thinke vpon great daye tarie till wee bee taken tardie comming oure lorde ieſus chriſte let euerie v condemne himſelfe god ſtirreth v therevnto furthermore let v alwayes beare remembraunce god oftentimes myndefull mercie middes diſpleaſure ſame cauſe hee examineth great multitude oure ſinnes great multitude oure ſinnes praye euerie man would examine himſelfe ought ſhould finde infinite number ſinnes yea ſo heynous offence would vtterly diſmay cauſe conſider greatneſſe ſinnes hypocriſie hindereth v keepeth eye blindfolded man would examine himſelfe throughly hee ſhoulde finde ſelfe hundred thouſande time confounded hee came halfe wayes ende god ſeeth muche cleerely wee doe vvhen haue ſpyed one fault god wil ſpie hundred thouſande yea euen million ſhall heauenly iudge doe let v marke god forbeareth v owne mercie ende would trie v multitude oure ſinnes ſay ſearch v vttermoſt eliu ſayth expreſly multitude greatly great number ſignifie impoſsible creature ſhoulde ſtande god goodneſſe ſpare continually abate rigoure puniſhmentes wee haue deſerued ſinnes heerevpon haue ſayde alreadie wee muſt needes thinke farre iudgement bee perceyued worlde howbeeit wee knowe yet god beareth v wee bee come lowlyneſſe condemne ourſelues craue forgiueneſſe hande let v doubte wee ſhall appeare iudgement ſeate latter day ſinnes ſhal wyped let v vnderſtande examining v hee doth nowe put v part end may examine thing al latter day remembrance offence may bee ſo aboliſhed may come account may bee receyued rightuous thoughe bin nothing v al innocencie ſoundneſſe ye ſee behoueth v ſo apply doctrine vſe may learne ſo walke hope wee may alwayes goe forwarde comming oure lorde ieſus chriſt alſo profite ſelues wee ſee oure lorde ſheweth v token wrath vengeance preſent ala calamity ſeene whole worlde wee might ſay god vtterly alienated v wee doctrine fenſe v withall surely wee doe throughly conſider outrageous iniquity reigne euerie appeareth playnly god beareth worlde proceedeth ſuche rigour men haue deſerued therefore let v learne hereby returne vnto better heart doubting hee receyue v beſides let v holde thoughtes affection fettered brideled much eliu hath condemned al wicked thought wandring wordes falſe ymaginations let v beſeech god firſt clenze heartes wicked fancy wherein bee much intangled therewithall bridle tongs may vtter thing honour according requeſt dauid maketh ſaying lorde open thou lippes mouth may ſet forth thy prayſe wee haue good cauſe praye god ſo gouerne myndes tung thought wordes may honour dauid ſo holie prophete needed craue hande neede ſo euill taught seeing ſo let v bee well aduiſed whenſoeuer wee thinke god wee eſteeme good wiſe rightuous reſpectes ſo euer wee ſpeake maye bee call vpon yelde thankes goodneſſe maketh v feele theſe dayes wayting till wee bee filled full nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying touche v ſo quicke may learne returne better vnto true repentaunce ſo bethinking v oure life paſte wee maye amende heereafter henceforth learne giue ſelues wholly ſeruice following holie commaundementes ſhewed lawe whereby wee ought rule oure whole life ſo let v ſay almightie god oure heauenly father wee acknowledge confeſſe c cxxxix sermon first vpon xxxvj chapter eliu ſpake againe ſayde 2 heare vvill argue vvith thee yet haue vvordes ſpeake god 3 vvill extend knovvledge farre proue rightuous vvhich made 4 vvordes ſhall voyde vntruth perfect knovvledge ſhall vvith thee 5 god mightie yea mightie ſtrength mynde enuieth reiecteth 6 quickneth vvicked giueth iudgement afflicted 7 vvill turne avvay eye rightuous heeeretofore vphild god leaueth ſinne vnpuniſhed world beguiled hath bin declared fully alreadie ſure ſee god reſerueth puniſhment many faultes ende make v looke ſhould execute full iudging wherin nothing miſsing ſhould haue occaſion hope cōming lord ieſus chriſt ſhuld haue iudging world would done afore hande god puniſhing ſinnes world time one rate ynoughe hee gyueth v ſome token markes iudge world like alſo perceyued mainteyning godly ſaid god gouerneth ſeruants preſeruer thoſe cō mit themſelues vnto deliuereth thē aduerſities yea howbeit done ſuch wiſe ſuffereth godly nowe afflicted yea ſeemeth minded ſuccor though call vppon therefore behoueth v ſo acknowledge god prouidence conſider reſerueth many thing till laſt daye matter eliu ſhould treat chapter importeth none thing open eies wee maye eaſily ſee god holdeth brydle worldly thing ſheweth himſelfe bee carefull ouer v true wee ſee ſo perfect good ſtate wiſhed farre wide howbeeit reaſon apparant namely god mynded exerciſe v heere mayne battayles againe hee intendeth drawe v namely make v knowe day come wherein thing ſhall bee ſtabliſhed againe ſo whereas thing go amiſſe nowe ende wee ſhoulde bee prouoked deſyre appearing sonne god ſette thing order againe according office hee hath promiſed ſo doo eliu treate foreſayde matter namely god gouerneth worlde diſpoſed thinges ſuche wyſe iuſtice ſheweth experience hee vſeth heere preface heare mee ſayeth hee haue yet matter ſpeake concerning god matter extende knowledge farre ſayeth hee proue • e made righteous eliu ſaying hee yet ſpeake god ſheweth faithfull man muſt giue ouer maintenance god quarell ende ſtoppe mouthes whiche murmure agaynſt blaſpheme truely wee little peece zeale commaunded v holy ſcripture woulde much earneſt mainteyning god honour bee ſayde pſalme reproches offered vnto god ought light vpon heades ſo touch v wee may feele heart bee greeued ſorie men v outrage poſsible bee thought wee wee hundred tymes miſuſed ought owne honour bee ſo much ſet handes honour god yet wee ſee cōtrarie ſo v defamed hee reuenge himſelfe leaſtwiſe ſeeke iuſtice neuer contented til honor bee repayred yet honour nothing wee name god ſhall bee rent peeces one ſhal villaynouſly skoffe another ſhal ſpewe curſed blaſphemies agaynſte thirde ſhall rayle geere paſſeth ſlippeth away amongs v man moued wee ſpeake one worde agaynſt wee thinke wee haue done ynough therefore wee ſuffer god doctrine ſlaundered maieſtie blaſphemed name runne mennes mouthes reproch therein wee ſhewe one droppe good zeale oure heartes cowardlyneſſe oures deſerueth god ſhoulde diſclayme v child wee tooke oure father coulde wee abide men ſhoulde aduaunce themſelues ſort agaynſte childe good nature woulde couer reproch carnall father although hee value ſhall wee matter concerneth wellſpring righteouſneſſe king glorie deſerueth prayſe ſcripture ſpeaketh effect ſelfe ſheweth wee clayme father yet notwithſtanding haue mouthes ſhette men go peruert truth name reuiled bee ſhort hee made open ſcoffingſtocke wee bee touched greeued wee woorthie bee acknowledged child wee ought marke text better ſayde yet hee ſpoken god worde yet importeth faythfull man hath ſette himſelfe agaynſte wicked whiche impeache god honour hee diſcharged ſhewing onely hee conſented vnto much v lyeth wee muſt vttermoſt withſtande reſiſt thoſe offer wrong vnto god go aboute diminiſhe deface glorie maner meanes vvee muſt ſay bee enimies vttermoſt neuer giue ouer battaile ſo holye iuſt quarell meane ſee wicked alwayes readie mainteyne euill caces theſe dayes wickeddeſt man ſhall finde moſt bearer bolſterers inſomuch man might conclude hee bee fauoured borne hee muſt giue himſelfe euill againe euerie man ſell conſcience tongue little good cheere ſome ſuche corruption theſe thing manifeſt yet meane whiche ſay haue ſome zeale god dumbe dare open lippes seeing theſe villaynes ſo outrageous pray ſhall neede recorde condemne thoſe haue courage ſtouteneſſe mainteyne god honour wickedneſſe ſeene wicked doo ſo linke togither euill thus goodneſſe yee ſhall finde man hazarde himſelfe wicked maye ſpight god theyr mainteyning wicked matter vnder colour ſome preſent ſhall bee giuen meane man ſhall haue minde mainteine goodneſſe therefore let v learne zealous god glorie wee haue beene firſt wee ſee men go ouerthrow good pure doctrine let v ſhewe fayth v make confeſsion withſtanding satan lie ſuch ſeeke nothing bring trouble ſtumblingblockes church god one poynt againe ſee god ſcorned dallyed withall men talking holy scripture bring religion diſdaine let v bee inflamed holy anger cauſe whiche ought moue v greeue v wee ſee god honour wounded religion miſuſed let v ſhewe wee haue yet talke god thirdely wee heare blaſphemyes flying abroade ſtreetes market vittayling houſes let v labour reſiſt vttermoſt power wee may ridde clenze away ſuch abhomination among v vvherefore muche v lyeth let v ſuffer god name bee reuyled concluſion whenſoeuer wee ſee euill raigne let v caſt ſtoppe labour amende god doo v honour acknowledge v proctor aduocates wee doo otherwiſe wee giue satan vpper hande guiltie betraying name god wee made account thing principall ſo ought taken wee haue marke vppon wordes eliu ſayeth yet hee bath ſtill ſpeake god afterwarde hee goeth forward ſame ſentence according alſo cace well woorthie faythfull ſhoulde imploy themſelues vttermoſt yea ſtreyne themſelues aboue force ſayeth wee extende knowledge farre therby hee ſheweth wee ſpeake god wee muſt lift vp mindes higher oure naturall vnderſtanding mounteth good ſooth ſhall man euer attaine vnto god hee iudge according owne fancie fleſhly reaſon wee ſhall rather darken glorie wee glorifie god let v learne reach knowledge farre wyde according example giuen v heere howe man ſhall neuer reach knowledge hee ought doo ſpeake god except hee knowe maieſtie higher vnderſtanding therefore muſt bee faine come downe v lift v vp vnto thus muſt wee humble ſelues reuerence ende god may lift v vp ſhewe himſelfe v make v partaker doctrine whiche otherwiſe wee coulde neuer attaine vntoo yeſee wee muſt reach knowledge farre wee haue deale concerning god nowe well obſerued wee ſhould profite another maner wee doo ſermons lecture come sermon howe diſpoſed receyue doctrine ſet foorth ynough come church ſhewe themſelues therefore goe theyr wayes ill came rather worſe good reaſon god ſhould puniſh thē blindneſſe doo ſo deſpiſe ineſtimable treaſure goſpell vvhen men come thither lazily without minde fall dumpes conſider god ſpeaketh vnto might honour receyue thing gone oute hys mouth traytors god yeelding ſo little honor doctrine ſaluation cauſe god blindeth vvhen read holy ſcripture either wee bee proude ſo ouerrun matter vpon truſt owne wit though wee ſufficient iudges determine vpon thing elſe mingle god worde worldly affection furthermore wee ſo farre reaching knowledge farre wee bee forepoſſeſſed owne fond trifling imagination wicked luſtes holde v locked bowed downe ſo wee cannot lift vp heades vntoo heauen cauſe ſee ſo ſlender profiting ſuche beare name faythfull knowe god neither deſire knowe therefore let v learne example eliu lift vp knowledge reach farre talking god let v learne alſo honour diſpoſe ourſelues looke reuerently vntoo alſo accompliſhing ſaying holye scripture god neere vnto lowly ſheweth himſelfe ſuch diſtruſt themſelues without challenging drop goodneſſe themſelues finally often ſpeake god let v giue owne braine bridle let v learne reach knowledge eliu addeth hee proue righteous made ſee whervnto talke ought tend whē ſpeake god namely mainteyning glory doctrine ſoeuer referred end muſt hold good holy like men reaſon diſpute diminiſhe honour god certaine nothing frowardneſſe howe faire colour ſoeuer pretend whenſoeuer wee ſpeake god let v beare minde proue righteous ſay yeelde duetie ſo hee may bee magnified handes wee acknowledge ſuche hee woulde bee knowne bee mouthes may bee ſhette haue occaſion miſlike thus yee ſee talke wee ought haue concerning god muſt bee ſanctifie name according alſo v wee deſire prayer wee vſe euerie daye eliu addeth immediately woordes ſhall bee voyde vntruth ſhewe vnto iob knowledge perfect heere hee proteſteth hee mingle anie thing good doctrine go diſguiſe ſurely one poynt whiche wee ought marke well wee open mouth treate god workes worde muſt bee mingling pureneſſe muſt kept ſo euer wee ſpeake whole ſound mingleth good matter euil matter togither dooth elſe bring good meate well ſeaſoned taſte yet notwithſtanding poyſoned euē ſo ſuch make faire ſhewe indeede alledge good true ſayings yet notwithſtanding interlace lye errours let v marke well hee executeth office teacher muſt onely regarde haue good ſayings ſpecially indeuer haue ſimplicitie hee neyther adde diminiſhe anie thing god pure doctrine therefore wee haue well ruled fayth muſt go lyne take good heede teaching wee vſe nothing guide v pure god wordes referred conformable therevntoo wee handle thing otherwiſe deale ſuch ſoundneſſe vprightneſſe god requireth wee ſay haue worde preached ſingleneſſe ſay haue minde v ſhall perceyue ende haue beene way heere wee taught receyue pure holy doctrine wee ought doo ſee bee mingled thing mingle poyſon good drinke good meate thing wee haue conſider elius wordes whereas hee ſayeth hee bee perfect knowledge towardes iob ſome men referred vntoo god eliu ſhoulde ſay ende iob ſhould perceyue ſet god ſchoole wee haue ſeene heretofore hee went doo ſette purpoſe bycauſe murmuring might ſeeme hee woulde haue ruled god owne manner bycauſe hee contented himſelfe hys dooings hee woulde haue founde fault haue reſerued ordinaunce cauſe ſome thinke eliu ſayth god ſhall bee found perfect knowledge howebeeit ſaying ought rather bee referred ſpeaketh hee ſhoulde ſay thou ſhalte perceyue faythfull teacher meening foraſmuche hee ſpeake god name iob ought well admitte woordes bycauſe hee woulde mingle adde thing owne handle true doctrine perfectly euen hee receyued god therefore man preacheth god magnifieth doctrine muſt bee taken though aduua • ced himſelfe much muſt exalt god truth aboue loftineſſe ſo nothing may deface thus yee ſee maner eliu ſpeaketh vaunte himſelfe owne perſon ende doctrine whiche hee bringeth according god might bee receyued euery man humble himſelfe vnder doubtleſſe monſtrous thing men fall ſtriuing agaynſt vvherefore let v vnderſtande ſuche perfection worlde ought holde mouthes ſhette acknowledge god ſhoulde bee ſo honoured ſpeaketh v euery man ought obey nowe let v come generall matter conteyned heere hithertoo eliu hath vſed preface nowe entereth pleading god cace ſayth god ſtrong deſpyſeth man verely ſayth ſtrength courage heere hee taketh grounde ſeparate god men take number intent wee ſhoulde thinke oure ſelues verie cauſe wee iudge amiſſe wee woulde alwayes faſhion ſmalneſſe ſhoulde ſay infinite difference power betwixt v men go reſemble god vntoo mortall man defacing maieſtie yet ordinarie inſomuche wee finde caces experience god vſe rigour wee fall ſurmiſing take occaſion repine agaynſte hee threaten v wee awhitte moued wee beare oure ſelues hande anger paſſe ouer cauſe ſo beaſtly preſumption wee diſcerne god creature alſo contrary part god promiſeth receyne v mercie wee cannot bee perſwaded ſo wee bee letted hindered oure owne imagination whiche make v thinke haue offended ſo muche ſo muche vvee make alwayes lyke mortall man therefore ſayd pſalme looke howe farre heauens earth ſo farre thoughtes hee confirmeth ſame ſaying prophete eſay howe nowe ſayeth hee thinke yee angrie manner thys ſerueth ſhewe v although wee haue prouoked hym vttermoſte yet hee bee mercyfull ſtill although wee bee totoo vnwoorthie yet hee ceaſſe reache oute helpe vntoo v wee ſee doctrine eliu ſuperfluous exceeding muche oure behoofe bycauſe verie withholde mingling god men ſo difference bee perceyued betwixte creature yet notwithſtanding tolde v greater difference betweene god v diſtaunce betweene heauen earth therefore wee muſte meaſure thoughtes ſpeake thing oure owne imagination vtter peruerting let v rememberhowe elius meening effect god ought bee ſo exalted aboue creature menne may preſume iudge owne naturall reaſon diſpoſition thing whiche ſee heere bylowe conſider hee farre thing farre differing v daye differeth night proofe heereof hee ſayeth god beeing ſtrong reiecteth man cauſe mortall man ſeeketh hurt neighbour puncheth elbowes ouerthrowe make ſtumble ſome meanes euen enuie ſpight one beareth another alſo feare haue whiche maketh ſaye ſuch one may doo mee harme ſuche man bee aduaunced ſhall bee plucked backe bycauſe ſo manie infirmity men alwayes afrayde leaſt theyr neighbour ſhoulde bee aduaunced muche cauſe full contention quarelles cauſe woulde alwayes haue diminiſhed great authoritie credite cauſe menne labour ſort bring neigbours lowe nowe let v ſee wee finde anie ſuche poynt god hee greate enuie v hee paſſeth men ſay coulde wee eyther hurt god diminiſhe honour though wee neuer ſo great king prince aduaūce throne aboue clowdes god hee aboue heauens yea aboue angelles men prophete eſay ſpeaking mennes pryde woulde ſo aduaunce themſelues ſayeth like graſhoppers yee ſee graſhoppers skippe make great leape bycauſe legges bee long yet fayne fall grounde againe elſe bee frogges thus yee ſee compariſon prophete ſetteth downe ſcorne vainegloriouſneſſe men admite wee coulde flee aboue clowdes admit wee fellowes angelles yet wee ſee doo worſhippe ſoueraine maieſtie god feyne hyde eye winges according ſayde prophecie eſay god • afrayde wee doo hurt neyther hee beare v enuie thoughe wee able anoy maieſtie ſhall alwayes continue vnappeached ſpight oure teeth seeing ſo wee muſt conclude proportion betwixt v imagin god offended hee hath good cauſe bee angrie feare leaſt men ſhould bereeue right true men blameworthie ſo yet thing preiudice infirmitie hee ſhoulde enuie hys creature hee great eliu addeth moreouer hee great ſtreength heart hee mightie vertue minde herein eliu toucheth another vice men euen whiche mightie ought enuie inferiours notwithſtanding ſo womaniſh hearted afrayde according wee ſee euen king prince whiche ſpightfull nature ſorie ſee vertuous man true nobleneſſe themſelues ſay god hath ordeyned aduaunce men vertue eſteeme honour cleane contrariwiſe foraſmuche bee bace minded themſelues would haue world like aſhamed ſee honeſt man bee prince would wallow filthineſſe keepe ſtewes court greeueth haue lewdneſſe diſcouered whereas whoredome reigneth euerie yet doth ſeeke ſtill get libertie giue himſelfe lewdneſſe aſmuch men ſeene bee ſo bace minded eliu ſayeth wee muſt imagine god bee faſhion beſydes hee mightie men notable reache vntoo hee alſo mightie vertue minde hee lyketh well vertue iuſtice pleaſeth hee alloweth goodneſſe hee ſeeketh meanes ſhewe vertue men better ſerued honoured thing wherein glorifying god conſiſteth men ſhoulde bee vertuous king ſee ſubiectes woorthie commendation himſelfe miſlyketh greeueth vvhy ſo bycauſe thing whiche others wanteth himſelfe ſo god haue men goodneſſe owne nature wee muſt bee faine receiue god wellſpring whence muſt come seeing ſo god needeth feare honour ſhould darkned men vertues marke heere wee haue conſider ſhall neuer knowe god bee righteous mightie himſelfe wee ought doo wee conſider naturall wit mindes groſſe heauie mounte ſo high wee ſee vertues grace whiche hee dealeth vntoo men thoſe fayre myrrours liuely picture wherein hee ſheweth himſelfe men walke righteouſneſſe hee continually magnifyed thing wherwith hee ſerued honoured wee ſee nowe wee muſt match god men iudge guize fancie muſt vtterly ſepatated according verie deede heauen ſo farre earth diſtance betwixt v haue alledged alreadie pſalmes prophet eſay nowe eliu hathe ſpoken ſo hee addeth whiche haue touched alreadie witte although many thing bee order worlde yet man maye perceyue markes god prouidence vndoubtedly although god nowe keepe one vnchaungeable rate yet notwithſtanding well ſeene god aboue thing worlde hee guided ſterne woulde bee horrible confuſion euerie therefore let ſuffice v haue heere ſome markes god prouidence ende wee may giue due glorie ſay lorde thou arte iudge worlde howeſoeuer thing fall althoughe thou leaue many ſinnes vnpuniſhed cauſe righteous innocent ſuffer many affliction yet neuertheleſſe wee perceyue thinges guided thy hande thou haſte ſouereyne dominion ouer thing yee ſee eliu treateth heere firſt hee ſayeth god quickneth wicked hee giueth iudgement afflicted hee turneth away eye righteous theſe ſentences whiche eliu taketh generall alſo behoueth v generally conclude god righteous euen wee perceyue ſigne righteouſneſſe wee muſt remember thing hath beene declared afore wee ſee thing ſet ſo good order perfection wee woulde wiſhe muſte put v minde god one daye iudge worlde perſon ſonne according article beleefe ieſus chriſt muſte come iudge quicke deade truely haue ſayde thing diſpoſed bee wiſhed matter vvee ſhoulde looke laſt reſurrection doo wee ſee god executeth iudgements reſerueth ſome himſelfe let ſame confirme v hope laſt daye comming lorde ieſus chriſt vntoo whome god father hath giuen power intent hee ſhoulde appeare maieſtie right thing order ſet ſtay wee ſee god puniſheth ſome offence delyuereth thoſe whether bee ſelues others let ſame ſuſfiſe v allowe prouidence ſee god hathe puniſhed ſuche fault muſte conclude hee hath ſhewed mee myrrour iuſtice wicked ſhall come account hee accepteth perſons hee earthly iudge wil doo good iuſtice ſtartes ſo bee ſome fault committed ſhall bee puniſhed great rigour meane many others ſhall bee let ſlippe ſome briberie parcialitie ſo ſhall iudge bee quite cleane chaunged euident inſomuch iuſtice worlde yea euen beſt bee founde theeuiſhneſſe bycauſe proceedeth good ſounde minde holdeth continually ſuche thing god hee moued fauour corrupted rewardes vvhat hee iudgeth according truth seeing ſo wee muſte needes conclude god puniſheth offence therein ſheweth v nothing eſcapeth woorkes muſt come account although bee hidden daye ſo bee perceyued firſt yet wee ſhall bee neuertheleſſe guiltie wee come thither let v learne practiſe leſſon ſhewed v heere wit god turneth away eye righteous • quickeneth wicked howe ſhall wee knowe alwayes one rate haue ſayde afore yet god giueth v ſufficient proofes conclude hee watcheth ouer godly ende maynteyne hee keepeth protection pitying deliuering daungers ſay wee ſee ſuche example heereof muſte needes haue matter fully ſettled concluded v furthermore wee ſee alſo god lifteth vp mightie hande repreſſe mennes iniquity howebeeit alwayes for▪ hee leaueth many vnpuniſhed winking yea making countenance thoughe hee fauored wicked many caces haue ſhewed alreadie ſame muſte confirme oure fayth wee muſte bee fenced agaynſt ſuche ſtumbling blockes knowing god reſerueth thoſe thing till latter daye whiche hee accompliſheth nowe howeſoeuer worlde go wee ſee inaſmuche god puniſheth ſuche offence hee hateth abhorreth ſinne therefore behoueth v iudge therevpon▪ hee quickneth wicked doctrine ſet downe heere teache v glorifie god reſpects ſo alſo let v marke muſte edifie oure fayth teache v feare god wee ſee god turneth away eye godly hath pitie vpon helpe let v bee ſtabliſhed truſte hys goodneſſe wee may reſort vntoo oft wee bee afflicted haue wee ſeene god hath deliuered man hee hath deliuered ſelues let ſame make v returne ſay howe nowe god hath made mee feele experience hee readie helpe ſuche truſt scripture ſayeth vntoo v come vntoo mee yee labour heauie loden refreſhe yee ſee recordes god giueth v witneſsing hee turne away eye godly muſte confirme v promiſes goodneſſe whiche hee giueth v alſo contrarie part whereas ſayde god quickneth wicked let v learne take vſe wee ſee crime puniſhed let prouoke v walke feare ſay dallying cace god vvhy ſo hee chaſteneth ſuch one intent inſtruct v harmes great fauour god ſheweth v hee giueth v ſuch example rigour wrath wee neuertheleſſe without touched may take warning eſchue vengeance readie v hee might haue made v feele thus yee ſee example chaſtiſements correction god doth worlde ought ſerue learning true wee well ſay god righteous ſuch one hath due reward wee skill condemne ſuch haue done amiſſe allowe correction god ſendeth meane wee applie thing owne vſe yet principall poynt vvhen ſee god puniſheth man muſt enter intoo ſelfe looke bee attainted ſame vice whether bee guiltie ſome reſpectes therevpon muſt humble ſelfe walke aduiſedly haue earſt done furthermore wee haue yet one frute bee taken chaſticements god ſendeth therein wee ſee alſo god hath care child god beate downe thoſe haue troubled one wronged another doth hee take quarrell hande wee ought better minded ſerue god wee ſee ſet himſelfe agaynſt enemy thunder vpon hee hath ſuffered haue ſcope tyme therefore haue declared afore ought confirmed leane vnto promiſe fayth without doubting ſhewe himſelfe father towardes v therewithall muſt bee hilde feare wee may preuent vengeance wee ſee light vpon wicked vpon deſpiſers maieſtie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele ſuch wiſe wee may learne bee ſorie yea bee angrie greeued vice ſinfull luſtes ſo wee may ſeeke earneſtly haue righteouſneſſe raygne v bee refourmed holy moreouer foraſmuche wee haue fight agaynſt temptation preſent life hee giue v armour defende ſelues withall althoughe wee knowe much miſerie wretchedneſſe ſelues yet wee may doubt hee vphold v ſupplie wantes grace according wee knowe perfection vertue goodneſſe giue ſame vntoo v according hee knoweth v haue neede may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules c cxl sermon ſecond vpon xxxvj chapter 6 quickneth vvicked giueth iudgement afflicted 7 vvill turne eye avvay righteous hee vvill ſet king ſeates ſhall bee exalted euer 8 ſtockes bound cordes affliction 6 hee vvill ſhewe faultes make feele ſinnes ſhall bee touched vvith 10 hee vvill open eare ende amende hee vvill ſpeake vnto make depart iniquitie 11 heare obey ſhall paſſe dayes proſperitie yeares glorie 12 heare ſhall paſſe ſvvorde conſumed vvithout knovvledge 13 hypocrite heart put vvrath crie euen vvhen bounde 14 therefore ſoule ſhall die youth life among vvhoremongers eliu hath generally ſayd god turneth eye frō righteous hath care contrarywiſe hee quickneth wicked addeth particularly better proofe god prouidēce giueth iudgement afflicted poore man vtterly deſtitute ſuccour outcaſt world neuertheleſſe deliuered vexation trouble ſame muſte needes proceede god yea ſay muſte needes bee fathered vpon god haue ſtay worlde yet haue ſtrong mighty enimies ſayd vndone hope life wee recouer manifeſt god worketh behalfe without cauſe eliu dothe purpoſely ſet downe ſaying proofe god gouerneth thing heere beneath alſo hee ſetteth downe ſecond example god prouidence namely gouernement prince men ſit ſeate iuſtice wherein wee perceyue god righteous haue thing bee order although bee continuall rate euenly kept tymes declared yeſterday yet notwithſtanding wee ſee order world therein may ſee glaſſe god hath ſo lette looce reynes confuzion doth ſtill ſhewe v ſome ſigne token iuſtice vndoubtedly man conſider one ſide nature man ſide maner gouerners magiſtrates ſuch haue ſwoorde iuſtice hande diſcharge themſelues hee ſhall ſee eaſely diſcerne bee miracle god common weale amongs v yea muſt needes know perceyue ſay nature men ſuch euery man would bee lord mayſter ouer neyghbours noman good would bee ſubiect seing lord ſuffereth ſtrongeſt preuayle ſome feare obedience towards thoſe preheminence therein bee ſeene god doth onely brydle alſo fetter men nature ende ſayd pryde auaunce ſelfe ſo high publike gouernment ſhoulde bee aboue agayne wee ſee men giuen euill iuſtes ſo boyling euery man would haue libertie liſt man vnder correction therefore bee concluded ſtate gouernment commeth god therein hee ſheweth creating men end ſhould behaue themſelues honeſtly modeſtly ſecond poynt ſee king prince ſuch meaner ſtate behaue themſelues god hathe armed ſwoorde iuſtice turne thing vpſide downe ſomuch ſeemeth intended ſpite god diſanull ordinance ought mainteyne peaſeably order god hath ſet inforce themſelues ouerthrowe fight ſet purpoſe bring thing confuziō yet ſtate gouernement continueth ſtill worlde thing ſo vtterly confounded abide ſtil ſome mark thing god ſtabliſhed bee ſeene therein god double righteous therefore without cauſe eliu hee hath ſpoken ſuccoring poore god addeth immediately one kinde namely god ſtabliſheth king one daye intent ſame order ſhoulde ſtand euer world true many chaunges fall great alteration vppon principality lordſhippes therein god ſhewed alſo office pull downe prowde yet neuertheleſſe euen deſpite men rage ſhall ſome order remayne ſtill heere belowe ſay euen reſpecte tyrant king reygne wrongfully ſo hee bee deſpizer god full crueltie outrage vnſatiable couetouſeneſſe yet notwithſtanding hee muſte bee fayne keepe ſome ſhadowe countenance iuſtice hee cannot go beyond vvhereof commeth bycauſe god ſheweth himſelfe therefore lette v learne profite ſelues ſuch wiſe thing ſeene world god may glorified hand hee deſerueth ſpecially wee ſee deliuer poore vtterly oppreſſed nother haue hope ſuccour men hand let v conſider mightie power goodneſſe diſpoze ſelues yeeld due prayze ſay thing haue note howbeit herewithall intent proue ſelues god childrē let v beware lend helping hand ſuch wrongfully perſecuted according abilitie god giueth v ſuccour ſuch trodē vnder foote haue meanes reuenge beare themſelues vvee muſt ſay indeuer behalf ſtreyne ſelues good earneſt secondly ſith wee ſee gouernours men authoritie ſo froward ſpitefull yet notwithſtanding god ſuffereth fall quite diſorder let v humble ſelues honour prouidence aſſuring ſelues hee reſtreyned wickedneſſe wee ſhould ouerwhelmed horrible fludde ſhoulde bee ſwallowed vp drowned hand therefore behoueth v magnifie god wee ſee remayneth ſome iuſtice good order although ſuch reygne holde ſwoorde hand vtterly wicked giuen naughtineſſe let v conſider ſame let v aſmuch v maynteyne order iuſtice ſo much ſoueraine benefit god beſtoweth vpō mankinde therein alſo hauē prouidence knowne vnto v ſith ſee • hat prince magiſtrates officer iuſtice ſo far ſquare let v bee ſory ſee order ſo peruerted god dedicated welfare men let v abhor ſuch enimies god withſtand order gouernment ſet ouer thē alſo let v know frutes ſins intēt may impute fault cauſe whole miſchiefe ſelues thus ye ſee haue remēber text let v come eliu addeth ſayeth good men elſe great men ſpoken god exalted high degree dignitie aboue reſt worlde bee time ſet ſtockes ſay time brought downe euen ſhame reproch ſo men put pryſon fetter bee tied confuzion coardes yet notwithſtanding god forſaketh thē ſuch neceſsitie maketh feele ſinnes telleth fault haue committed ende vpon knowledge may amend returne right way openeth care ende ſhould bethinke thēſelues better know thēſelues eliu ſheweth whē god ſeemeth vnto v ſhet eye regard nomore gouerning men hee hath iuſt cauſe ſo although wee thinke ſtraunge yet muſte wee acknowledge hee iuſte rightuous doings wee haue cauſe • oo glorifie truely behoueth v beare continually minde thing haue beene treated heretofore wit thing ruled worlde one rate god reſerueth great part iudgements intendeth execute vnto latter day intent ſhould always liue hope wayting comming lord ieſus chriſt muſt ſuffize v haue ſome token whereby perceiue thing • olde v heere nowe intent eliu preuent ſtumblingblocke menne might conceyue whē ſee good rightuous folkes trampled vnder foote god layeth open tyrannie wicked worlde troubleth without cauſe ſo although haue done bodie wrong yet neuertheleſſe menne ceaſſe moleſt wee ſee ſeemeth v god thinketh vpon worlde ne looketh ſo farre vnto v letteth fortune alone rule thing lo howe oure eyeſight immediatly dazeled beholding thing order nothing eaſie v ſtumble cauſe eliu ſheweth v heere although good menne perſecuted elſe ſuch aduaunced great eſtate bee ouerthrowne ſo god ſeemeth confounde heauen earth togither wee muſte therefore bee ſore diſmayed oure mindes god hath ſome iuſtereaſon wee able conceyue firſte brunt let v tarie pacience wee ſhall knowe god make ſuch affliction v good tende good ende ſayeth doth god ſhewe ſinnes ſo tormented maketh perceyue ende bring good amendment nowe wee ſee firſt wee muſt deeme thing outward apparance gage deeper ſeeke cauſe moueth god doo thing wee thinke ſtraunge firſt ſight ſeemeth cleane contrarie reaſon good man ſhould bee ſo perſecuted euery man ſhould ouerrunne howbeeit god knoweth hee doth therefore wee muſt haue eye end haſtie ſhoote foorth verdit firſt daſh iudge auentures ende affliction make v perceyue ſinnes notable poynt whereof wee may gather profitable leſſon true wee heare oftentimes ſpoken neuertheleſſe wee cannot heare much wee know affliction ſo irkſome v euery v falleth chafing ſoone wee feele ſtrype rodde god hande wee cannot comfort ſelues keepe ſelues pacience therefore ſo much behoueth v marke well doctrine god ſuffereth v bee vexed euen wrongfully reſpect world euen doth worke welfare make v feele ſinnes ſhew v time proſperitie wee bee blinde ſurely wee ſhall know aright conteyned vnleſſe god bring v chaſtyzements wee eaſe pleaſure euery v falleth aſleepe flattereth himſelfe ſinnes ſomuch proſperitie drunkenneſſe caſt ſoules dead ſleepe woorſe god letteth v alone peace although wee haue offended thouſand wayes yet wee ceaſſe ſooth ſelues bearing ſelues hande fauour loueth v bicauſe ſcourgeth v ye ſee menne cannot perceiue owne ſinnes driuen force knowe thē ſelues therefore ſeing proſperitie maketh v drunken ſort reſt euery man flattereth himſelf ſinnes ſtandeth v vpon ſuffer god paciently ſcourge v affliction true ſchoolemiſtreſſe bring men repentance ende may condemne themſelues god ſo condemned learne hate ſinnes wherin weltered aſore therefore wee knowe frute chaſtizements god ſendeth v wee beare meelder quieter minde wee doo piteous caſe ſee howe recheleſſe wee bycauſe wee know god procureth welfare afflicting v maner furthermore lette v marke well wee muſte looke vpon viſible hande god feeling ſinnes may come paſſe god giue menne brydle ſo ſhall perſecute v yea euen vniuſtly wee ſhall haue done wrong yet euen cace behoueth v learne god calleth v vntoo ſchoole forbearing ſmyte v owne hande putting v intoo handes wicked tame v meeken v better doth hee put v ſhame wicked haue full ſcope ſo lyeth hande torment v doo woorſt vnto v one god ſhoulde tell v wee bee woorthie bee beaten owne hand intendeth ſhame v much therefore muſt wee bee prouoked thinke vppon ſinnes bee ſorie therewithall marke eliu addeth god dooth open eares ſaying betokeneth twoo thing holy scripture ſometymes ſignifieth ſpeake v ſometymes ſignifieth touche heart ſuch wiſe wee heare ſayde v god therefore openeth eares hee ſendeth v woorde cauſeth ſame bee ſette v agayne hee openeth eares hee vncouereth vnſtoppeth hebrewe woorde doth conueniently importe muche wee ſuffereth v bee deafe doctrine giueth enterance v ende wee may receyue bee moued power therof may ſhewe ſelfe theſe ſay two ſortes opening eares wee dayly perceyue god vſe towards v alſo hee openeth eares thoſe hee afflicteth hee giueth ſome ſigne wrath thereby teach bethinke themſelues better haue done man demaunde dothe god ſpeake v wee bee proſperitie yes ſurely doth voyce cānot come vnto v fraughted aforehād owne delight worldly affection vndoubtedly wee ſee men haue fill good cheere may make merry owne pleaſure liue helth welth ouerioy themſelues none talke thē ſporting ſuch wiſe god heard among affliction meſſengers wrath wee touched greefe offending ſo call ſelues home againe ſo affliction muſte generally ſerue inſtruction ſuch receyue thē ſo may drawe homeward vnto god haue hilde themſelues aloofe marke one poynt yet notwithſtanding men ſuffer themſelues bee gouerned god vntill hee haue ſoftened hart holy ſpirite opened paſſage warning hee giueth perced men eares may yeelde ſeruice obedience ſayd pſalme wee haue marke therefore wee afflicted firſt let v remember one god ſhould ſpeake vnto v ſhewe v ſinnes indited v intent drawe v repentance howbeeit foraſmuch wee dull vpon ſpurre wee bee vtterly ſtubborne deafe vntoo warning hee giueth v behoueth v pray perce eares open ſuch wiſe inſtructions ſame may turne profite hee ſuffer ayre onely beaten without touching heart hee moue v come returne vnto otherwiſe let v bee ſure wee ſhall doo nothing chafe reiect correction accordings experience ſheweth moſte men ſuch ſmitten god ſcourges amende rather wexe woorſe woorſe ſith wee ſee ſuch example let v learne purpoſe till god open eares ſay till haue made v heare ſpeake v woorking holy ſpirite alſo obey wee haue ſo heard lo haue marke vpon ſtreyne addeth immediatly heare obey ſhall ſpende dayes weale yeeres glory berken ſhall paſſe ſwoorde dye without knowledge heere eliu ſheweth v yet better profite wee haue aduerſitie vndoubtedly great benefite
