cannot bee ſufficiently valued drawne repentance whereas wee high way damnation lord bringeth v backe himſelfe ſay thing ought aſſwage ſorrowe affliction howbeeit yet much namely lorde ſheweth v proofe profitable ſame v ende wee may bee deliuered aduerſities ſuccored ſhew himſelfe fauorable v meanes seing found experience haue wee cauſe bee glad god deliuereth v ſorte hee ſhould ſuffer v ſotted pleaſures worlde ende wee woulde growe paſte grace therefore hee fayne remedie due ſeaſon hee afflicting v therevpon deliuer v intent wee ſhould perceyue hande ſingular proofe fauour fayth god ſhould ſuffer v welter filthineſſe ſettle owne lee prophet terme wee would rotte away haue ſayde afore beſides would eſteeme grace towards v ſuch hee ſheweth taking v aduerſities wherevnto wee fallen lo heere double benefite redoundeth vnto men god correcting manner firſt formeſt bee brought backe vntoo ſecondly perceyue fatherly goodneſſe bee deliuered grace thus ye • ſee wee haue marke ſtreyne nowe man might demaund yea ſo wee ſure god intent drawe v repentance hee ſcourgeth v himſelfe hee ſuffereth v troubled man vvhat wee tell whither purpoſe ſuch herevnto anſwere aſmuch wee ſee affliction laſt time god deliuereth v lette v vnderſtand thereby hee mindeth vndo v vtterly contented bee beaten downe humbled vnder hand neckes braſſe withſtand ſo bowe correction hee ſendeth v wee nothing elſe continually double ſtrokes contrary parte feele ſinnes ſo craue forgiueneſſe perceyue v rightly touched maketh hee aduerſities turne wholeſome medicine v therevpon hee deliuereth v vve ſee ſay euen eye lette v grudge wee ſee god ſende ſuch trouble worlde nother lette v offended though eye ſhet hee knoweth well ynough doth hath infinite wiſdom appeereth v firſt daſh ende wee ſhall ſee hee hath diſpozed thing good order meaſure alſo let v learne herewithall much greeued wee afflicted manner aſſuring ſelues god doth meanes ſaluation agayne would wee healed wee ſo trouble payne woulde haue good deſirable ende let v followe way ſhewed v heere namely heare obey heare taught whē god holdeth v ſchole ſo affliction may many inſtructiōs reſort vnto let v heare theſe thing let ſlippe one eare whiche entered let v obey ſay let v yeelde god ſuch obedience ought let v ſeeke thing elſe thā frame ourſelues wholly vnto lo meanes may ridde aduerſities muſte maruell though men linger payne yea bee plundged dayly deeper deeper miſeries giueth eare vnto god hee ſpeaketh apparant number afflicted tormented euident god ſcourges occupied euery nowadayes thinke vpon ye ſhall ſee whole realme oppreſſed warres till yet ſhall yee ſcarce finde dozen men among hundred thouſand heare god ſpeake beholde yerkes laſſhes whippes ſound roare ayre horrible weeping wayling euery men cry ala wo mee yet whyle looke hande ſmiteth according prophete vpbraydeth ſtubborneharted whereas feele ſtrokes yet perceyue god hande vve ſee lyke plague time dearth woonder god ſende incurable woundes put thing vre ſayde prophete eſay namely ſole foote crowne heade ſoundeneſſe people lyke leproſie ſo bee rotten filthie ſores paſte recouerie wondered ſeeing nowadayes men ſo thankleſſe godwarde ſhet doores heare myghte obey wherefore whenſoeuer beaten god ſcourges let v learne come vnto herken warning giueth v ſo may feele ſinnes miſlike doone lette v hartely ſorie ende may pleaſe haue pitie vppon v wee go woorke ſorte god forgette owne chardge inſtructing v delyuering v aduerſities wee needes play reſtie iades hee hamper v well ynough according ſayde heere wee ſhall paſſe ſwoorde bee conſumed without knowledge ſay owne follie vvhereas ſayde wee ſhall paſſe ſwoorde meening woundes ſhall bee vtterly vncurable ſo muſt hope healing ſhall bee remedie v wilfull god warneth v faultes ſhewe himſelfe good phiſition towardes v purging v leaſtwiſe wee paſte amendement nother reaſon amendment v ſo chawe vpon brydle without feeling ſinnes ſorie lette v aſſure ſelues affliction worlde ſhall bee deathfull vnto v wee learne returne vnto god calleth v giueth v ſpace repentaunce ſay wee come tyme conuenient enter gate open v ſay ſo chaſtizements giuen v welfare turne greater damnation muſte many ſummonings inſomuche fulneſſe miſerie muſte bee accompliſhed vpon v muche muſte wee bethinke ourſelues wee prouoke ſuche vengeance god vppon v wilfully ſmall matter ſayde v wilfull ſorte muſt wounded god owne hande namely bycauſe men aſmuche • ▪poſsible de • ie yeeld vnto ſo fauorable wa • ne giueth enterance vnto good ſooth • menne checke god wi •• open defying atreading grace vnder foote god cannot away ſuche ſpitefulneſſe prophete eſay ſweareth owne maieſtie menne make ſcorning ſaye lette v eate drinke god calleth repentāce ſinne ſhall neuer bee blotted beholde ſay god ſo diſpleaſed ſinne hee ſweareth hee wyll beare remembraunce euer muche therefore ought prouoke v humble ſelues god gyueth v forewarning aſſuring ourſelues procureth welfare behalf end ſhould ſhake yoke intendeth laye vpon v beate backe ſtrokes rod whiche hee gyueth v though h •• ſmote vpon stith ſayde expreſly ſuche • giue care vnto god ſhall die without knowledge ſay owne folly ſhall vndo ſayde end men ſhould left without excuſe true wee ſhielde ſelues ignorance wee go qualifie fault elſe wipe quite away vvee ſay thought ſuch thing wiſt let v learne know mention made men ignorace condemnethem bicauſe played beaſts reaſon euen ſo doth prophet eſay ſpeake thereof cauſe ſayeth lorde hell open graue ſwalloweth vp thing people conſumed knowledge god complayneth ſinners caſting themſelues wilfully deſtruction therewithall ſayeth befe •• want knowledge yea immediatly hee vpbraydeth iewes become brutiſh lorde behalfe doth ſufficiently warne v long none ſelues well taught truly god good ſcholemaiſter bee ill ſcholers god ſpeaketh v deafe el ſtoppe eares intent would heare ignorance whereof eliu ſpeaketh wilfull bicauſe men cannot finde heart god ſhould poynt leſſon teach come vnto • ad leuer folow continually common trace therfore ſhet eye ſtop eares thus ye ſee ignorāce full wilfulneſſe ſtubborneſſe true time wicked like well thēſelues feele god hande howbeeit ſo muche worſe wee ſee example day day man ſpeake theſe vnthrifts giuen al naughtineſſe threaten god vengeance nodde head make mocke bearing themſelues hande ſporting matter agayne take ſermons ſcorne turne holy scripture skoffing ende ſhoulde haue reuerence authoritie vvee ſee eye howbeeit alwayes impayre cace ſurely ſaying ſhall fall ground namely whoſoeuer heare god affliction muſte needes periſhe without knowledge ſay ignorance wherin ouerſotted muſt cauſe haue greater fall plundge deeper god curſe ſith ſee let v learne beteachable aſſoone god ſpeaketh let v gyue care ready ſubmit ourſelues worde let nothing hinder v returning vnto thing taught ſentēce ſurely nature would otherwiſe alwayes egge v ſtriue agaynſte ſayd furthermore appeareth men foliſhneſſe although counted fooles vnaduiſed yet labour excuze themſelues follye ignorance commeth making theyr account afore god ſhal auaile al therfore ſtādeth v hand labour humilitie betimes reſort comfort god giueth v ſayeth hee teacheth v double meanes one ſide maketh woorde preached vnto v otherſide hee beateth v rod ende euery v owne behalfe ſhould moued returne right way therfore let v haue eares open receyue doctrine ſet afore v name god ende ſpeake deaf folkes block wood therwithall alſo let v bee pacient abyde affliction ſhall ſend v thing falleth liking let v therfore ceaſſe magnifie god grace ſtill aſſuring ſelues meanes maketh v feele ſins intent ſhouldnot ſo ſaped periſhe yee ſee vnleſſe wee ſpite god wilfully haue heard woord behoueth v alſo vnderſtande intendeth chaſtizing v ſending aduerſities vpon v whiche ſide ſoeuer come ſhall neuer happen v thing hande eliu addeth hypocrite heart doo put wrath cry bound ſoule ſhall die youth ſhall periſhe whoremonger hee ſayeth hypocaites heart doeth terme ſo hee meeneth thoſe imbrued naughtineſſe haue backenooke ſhrinke god cannot bee drawen ſoundeneſſe wee ſhall ſee many poore ſoules ſinne ouerſight bycauſe bee vnconſtant ſo bee eaſily thruſt way yet malicious rooted wilful ſtubborneneſſe otherſome whiche hypocrite heart ſay whiche haue roote contēpt al ſtubbornneſſe ſo mocke god haue reuerence worde diuell hath ſo bewitched condemne good folow euil leſtwiſe allow could find hart delight feede therfore let v marke well whereas eliu ſpeaketh heere hypocrite hart meeneth ſuch ſo wholly giuen ouer vnto satan ſinne ouerſight ſo wholly framed vnto euill fully bent ſay miſcheefe mocke god ſuch maner mē many exāples bee ſeene man cōpare thoſe vnconſtant offend frailtie wicked deſpiſers god number wicked bee far greater ſo let v marke without cauſe eliu calleth hypocrite heart frowardharted ſay vtterly giuen extreme naughtineſſe maliciouſneſſe ſo aduerſities meanes ſubmitte themſelues vnto god rather put wrath let v marke well ſaying putting wrath aſmuch kindle fire ſtill throw wood increace good ſooth froward ſorte ſtriue ſtomake agaynſt god wiſe amend cace ſtate ala doo heape vp wood wrathe god muſte needes burne whotter let v marke reſiſt god chaſtizemēts thinking beate backe wilſulneſſe frowardneſſe wee ſhall increace wrath god curſe ſhall augment till vtterly cōſumed whē heare haue wee pray god firſte purge v ſuche wiſe may haue ſayde rooted ſtubbornneſſe priuie ſpytefulnes v although haue done amiſſe infirmitie yet may alwayes bee ſome roote feare god v ſo become vtterly paſt amēdment alſo let v euer indeuer inure ſelues ſayd ſoberneſſe ſingleneſſe hart ende bee ſo ſnarled ſinnes like wel foſter moreouer let v marke well wee worke wyles pollex god market ſhall amended awhit wee ſhall rather increace wrath towards v ye ſee thē men ought looke wel amēding euill doings ſeing god curſe ſhall ſo increaced vpō expreſſe mention made increaſing god wrath bycauſe men thinke themſelues ſcaped whē god hath deliuered frō ſome one miſchaūce thinke worſt paſte thinke vpō meanes hidden v namely god anon bring foorth new roddes draw new ſwordes ſuddenly thunder vpon v looke aſmuch wee ſufficiently afrayde god wrath therfore purpoſely ſayd ſame increaceth heape vpō v inſomuch hundred thouſand death muſte needes way te vpon v wee ſhall haue deſpiſed meſſage god ſent v bring v backe agayne guide v right way therefore wee ſhall haue deſpized god warning ſort muſte fayne feele horrible vengeance vpon v whereas otherwiſe proteſteth alwayes ready cōfort ſuch ſubmit themſelues willingly good let v fal downe face good god acknowledgemēt fault praying correcting v feeling ſtripes may vayne may learne thereby returne vnto ſo may tary till ſhewe v ſome ſigne wrath foraſmuche wee dayly allured word ſo louing gentle faſhion ſee may grow hardharted rather giue diligēt eare ſhall ſay wee may preuent iudgement whenſoeuer liſteth execute rigour vpon v ſinnes wee may therefore ceaſſe haue eye continually promiſſe hope hee hath made v feele owne miſeries deliuer v namely vpon conditiō wee learne ſorie forſake may pleaſe graunt grace onely v alſo people nation earth c cxlj sermon third vpon xxxvj chapter 15 ſetteth aſide poore affliction openeth eares oppreſsion 16 truly vvoulde plucke thee mouth diſtreſſe ſet thee large place vvhere ſhould ſtreyghtneſſe reſt thy table ſhould full fat 17 thou haſt filled iudgement vvicked yet ſhall iudgement iuſtice holde 18 behold vvrath ende hee deſtroy thee vvith thine abilitie multitude giftes deliuer thee 19 vvill regarde thy greatneſſe thy prouiſion thy force haue ſeene heeretofore men gayne nothing ſtryuing againſt god rather impaire cace hardhartedneſſe increaſeth god vengeāce kindleth fire nowe moreouer ſayde concluſion ſuch needes play rebelles maner againſt god ſhall die floure youth whoremonger man ſhoulde ſay cōmon language looke vpon yonder vile ribaulde hanged euen ſo ſayde deſpizers god ſhall dye theyr ſtrength ſee thēſelues eaſe full fierceneſſe pride yet ſhall god conſume well ynough eliu doth new againe ſet downe ſayd afore namely god openeth eares thoſe whome hee afflicteth without cauſe repeted foraſmuch hard make mē beleeue yet withſtāding may well cōſider doctrine neceſſary v affliction hard cōberſome v ſo much chafe fret cannot abide god hand rather thinke doth v wrōg bycauſe know frute commeth therefore cannot told v oft god openeth men eares whē hee afflicteth thē ſame cauſe ſayd alſo god ſetteth aſide ſholeth thē affliction true ſome tranſlate deliuer according alſo taken ſenſe howbeeit ment god taketh oute theyr affliction ſette downe affliction ſimilitude eliu vſeth hee ſhoulde ſaye god ſholeth gathereth himſelfe thoſe whome chaſtizeth bycauſe menne proſperitie wander dote owne imaginacions ſoone god layeth hande vpon maketh feele rigour one ſhould take aſide himſelfe ſhew fault bring repentance ſee effect eliu ment ſay lette v marke well opening men eares affliction bycauſe whyle wee lyue eaſe pleaſure oure eye blindfolded according pſalme ſayeth men proſperitie eye ſtroute fatneſſe ſo ſee whit therefore vtterly ſotted ſinnes alſo wee haue eares ſtopped proſperitie cannot heare whit therfore lord neede open affliction truely doctrine ſufficiently prooued common experience wee neede ſeeke expoſition darke thing ſee ſuche pinched aduerſitie cannot awaye correction aſſoone ſpoken chafe ſeene euery ſeuerall perſon alſo whole body realme long warre peſtilence famine ſee men rebuked ſinnes murmure nothing reſiſtance tooth nayle ſo haue ſayde bicauſe men eares ſtopped fatneſſe cannot abyde god ſhoulde wiſe tell ſinnes elſe men ſo proude ſtriue againſt admoniſhmentes yet ſhall little auayle ſpeake purpoſe finde fault paſſe vvhy ſo euery man full fraught aforehande owne delyghtes pleaſures bee ſhorte wee neuer touched tyll god hande nyppe v chaſtyzing v cauſe ſo many calamity happen worlde aſmuche men giue eare vntoo god ne make account worde longer vſeth force hand agaynſte hee ſeeth ſo puffed vp pryde cannot otherwiſe weeld hee tameth ſubdueth folke mayne force yet ſame ynough time howe many bee ſeene reſiſt god hand wilfull ſtubbornneſſe continue alwayes hardharted ſo growe woorſe woorſe feele ſtrypes common thing place preciſelye ſpoken thoſe whome god intendeth ſhewe fauour afflicting men hee ameth twoo endes reprobate purpoſeth make vnexcuſable godly hee intendeth tame ſuch wiſe may returne lowly mind ſentence mention made ſuch god ſuffer periſhe cauſe doth chaſtize nowe needefull god ſhould worke ſo towards chozen neede generally mankind mention made thoſe whome god knoweth auoweth child whoſe ſaluation intendeth procure gouerning holy ſpirite yet notwithſtā ding euen ſhould haue eares ſtopped ſhoulde bee ſotted owne pleaſures god drewe himſelf affliction therfore let v learne heere horrible frowardneſſe nature furthermore although lorde haue touched v ſo haue ſome good deſire come yet let v ſure haue ſtill nede help namely lord ſhould pricke v ſpurre v forward meanes poſsible ſubdue v ſtandeth v hand ſerue owne turnes trouble aduerſities ſendeth v ſo may apply ſayde vſe aſſuring ſelues would nothing rebellion fleſhe ſubdewed maner thus yee ſee haue beare minde furthermore lette v learne ſtubborne againſt god hee afflicteth v ſeeing knowe intent open eares let v pray afflictiōs may ſo auayle profit v may come vnto make v go forward ſtill good way hee hath brought v bring paſſe let v learne gad luſts ſee moſte men caryed away god calleth runne finde way come therefore let v ſet ſelues aſide ſay lette v bee gathered vnto god ſo ſotted owne vanity wicked affection wee ſee ſelues much giuen thus yee ſee effecte wee haue remember ſentence nowe hee addeth immediatlye god plucke man • rim properly mouth anguiſh affliction ſet large place ſhall bee distreſſe reste table ſhall full fatte woord rest may taken well thing ſet vpon table ſo ſhall bee furniſhed good thing alſo eaſe quietneſſe ſhall table purpoſely ſpoken vnto iob bicauſe felt god bountifulneſſe doubteleſſe eliu vpbraydeth vnthankefulneſſe come ſayth haſt thou knowne heretofore god made thee proſper▪ vvhence came al rich whiche thou diddeſt poſſeſſe bounteouſneſſe whiche god ſhewed towards thee ſurely would ſtill ſhew himſelfe ſame thou wart meete hādled ſo gently hand certaine would go began thou hast perfourmed iudgement wicked thou ſeeſt thou canſt abyde god ſhould thee good true iob accuſed partly wrongfully neuertheleſſe withoute cauſe eliu condemneth grudging againſt god telleth iudgement iustice ſhall hold withſtanding murmuring meane whyle wee may gather good leſſon verſe whē god ſcourgeth v muſt cal minde good hath done v end troubled conſider chaſtizemēts hande done without cauſe poynt alſo wherevntoo dauid bringeth v god exalted ſeate kingdome giuen ſo many victory againſt enimies came extremely afflicted ſeemed ſhould vtterly ouerwhelmed acknowledged foraſmuch god creature behoueth v hād hee may diſpoſe v pleaſure wee muſte beare patiently chaſtiſemēts ſendeth therfore let v learne apply ſentence inſtructiō ſo beatē god roddes may cal minde benefites hee hath beſtowed vpon v ende may yeelde ſelues wholly acknowldge good reaſon hee ſhoulde turne v fro pleaſure therwithall remēbring alſo ſerue aſſuage greefes neuer felt thā rigor god hand would ſo far pacience affliction ſhould haue heart call vpon god flee refuge wee knowe hee hathe ſhewed himſelfe father towards v drawne v gentleneſſe maketh hee v feele ſuche truſte ſuffer themſelues bee gouerned hande happie thus ye ſee giueth v courage comfort euen middes trouble therfore let v marke well wee bee pinched aduerſities affliction thing wee feele preſently muſte ſo amaze wittes ſhoulde thinke vpon god goodneſſe vpon comfort hath giuen v goulfe hell thinke vpon nothing preſent chaſtizements vvhat lette v mingle god goodneſſe rigor haue receyued good god hande lette v ceaſſe flee vnto afflicteth v hoping bring trouble good end ſeing hath made v feele already experience ſuch ſo referre themſelues vnto doo finde good pitifull father thus yee ſee holy ghoſte ment teache v heere mouth eliu nowe let v come verſe ſayde iob fulfilled iudgemente wicked true theſe wordes may alſo taken though ſayd filled iuſtice iudgement iudgementes iniquitie true meening iob ouerſhot himſelfe ſo farre cupple himſelfe wicked men neuertheleſſe ment life though bene theefe whoremōger murtherer though hee bene blaſphemer looce liuer eliu ment none thoſe thing meening iob glorified god aduerſities repyned muche agaynſt yea gone aboute exalte himſelfe though god done wrong vſed crueltie towards thus ye ſee wherein iob condemned led leude life hee borne aduerſitie paciently ynoughe called fulfilling iudgement wicked ſay agreeing theyr faſhions enormity wee haue alſo note nothing precious vntoo god glorie owne name true menne gyue themſelues ſome whoredome ſome outrage ſome gluttonie therein god iuſtice impeached order hath ſette among v peruerted broken much v lyeth god maieſtie alwayes defaced yet notwithſtanding man blaſphemeth god openly humbleth himſelfe vnder hand doubte exceedeth ſinnes bee condemned greeuouſly therefore wee ought marke well ſtreine iob vpbraided fulfilling iudgement wicked nowe wee may take profite ſentence behoueth v marke firſte ſoone man ſteppeth way ſtreytwayes beginneth intāgle himſelf wicked much bereeueth himſelfe god grace howbeit ſtumble ſo groſly firſt brunt wyll ſeeme vntoo v faultes bee meane ende runne ſo farre blaſpheme god deſpize ſuche ſort diuell himſelfe ſhall ſtirre v agaynſt ſhall inflamed rage madneſſe ſpyte cannot bee done deſtruction▪ lo befalleth vntoo men iob ſo liued ſo holily mirrour angelical perfectiō vve haue ſeene hath proteſted heretofore namely bene defender fatherleſſe maynteyner widowes eye blinde foote lame table bene free poore folk come vnto clothed naked wool ſheepe abuſed credite oppreſſe body withall although worlde might haue done many extortiōs yet notwithſtāding ſee ouerſhot himſelfe god hand preſſed ſuch vehemēcie vvhat thing wee deſpite god wittingly willingly tolde euen men ſteppe way forthwith much ſeparate themſelues god take hygh way caſte themſelues satan ſnares therfore let v take good hede ſelues though haue liued neuer ſo rightuouſly let v ſure wee hilde ſtill grace god holy ſpirite ſhal ſoone giue ſlip inſomuche wee ſhall good giuen ouer euen turning hand ſuche frayltie v wee may ſo ſoone fall euill ſhall become v wee ſhall haue gone foreward cōtinued long time prouoking god wrath aſmuch lay v quite quenched light holy ſpirit vvherefore let v bethinke v well walke ſuche feare vpon knowledge owne feebleneſſe wee may blinded preſumption rather pray god guyde v hold v mightie hande ſuffer v wiſe fall happen ſuffer v ſwarue neuertheleſſe ſo hold v vp may come full poynt iniquitie ſoone ſhall haue done amiſſe may bee ſorie flee mercie thus yee ſee haue marke verſe may hild better feare god lette v marke well eliu addeth iudgement iustice ſhall hold ſtill ſhould ſay men may well play mad bedlems yet ſhall god continue ſtill ful ſtate end force become theyr iudge though men aduance themſelues neuer ſomuche yet ſhall come vnto maieſtie god vve may well take coū ſell agaynſt ſhall neuer atteyne ſo high although could plucke sunne skie yet could touch god herfore let v learn men warned skirmiſh agaynſt god woont though able ouermatch get vpper hand know told v iudgement iuſtice ſhall hold ſtill ſee intent eliu lette v apply ſayings vſe haue told already men make boanes pleade agaynſt god ſo meaſure knowledge haue themſelues conceyue infinite maieſtie would ſoone daſh prittleprattle therfore whēſoeuer wee tempted ſet ourſelues againſt god grudge againſt iuſtice let come remembrance thinke ſhall gayne yet ſhall iudgement iuſtice hold ſtill ſay cannot let god ſhoulde reigne nother cā deuice al againſt ſeing god iuſtice infinite iudgements ſhall cō tinue euermore full ſtrength force remayneth v ſhrinke head ſubmit ſelues wholly vnto haue beare minde purpoſe receyue good inſtructiō text lette v beguyle ſelues vayne preſumption ſee moſt men bleare eye wilfully let v yeelde god duetie wit ryghtuouſneſſe cannot bee diminiſhed v iuſtice whiche wee meanes preiudice vvhen wee haue concluded ſhall aduiſed ſober haue bene woont bee ſhal haue tongue filed plead god wee ſhall humilitie acknowledge fault ſorie wee haue offended wee bee trouble wee ſhall perceyue behooſe bee chaſtized hand ſchoole paſſing profitable v cōſidering herken woorde excepte hee dryue v thereto force thus ye ſee haue remember concerning leſſon nowe ſayde beeing angrie ende man ſhoulde bee confounded abilitie ſayeth remedie hee paſſe golde ſiluer force worlde lo heere goodly confirmation wee haue touched already wit god cauſing v feele wrath ende ſhould vtterly deſtroyed hee ſpare v wee doo nothing elſe harden vvhen men haue ſtepped awry god beareth hee forbeareth growe brutiſh although vſing gentleneſſe towards v intent winne v meane yet notwithſtanding nature ſo frowarde ſteade comming wee dragge ſtill ſhorte wee ſee common thing amōg men dally god vſeth gently nothing elſe mocke goodneſſe pacience foraſmuche ſo god muſte needes vtter wrath elſe ſhoulde v periſhe long forbearing v would augmenting damnation▪ sainct paule meeneth ſayeth god afflicting v ende ſhould periſh worlde therefore behooueth v good comfort middes trouble ſeeing god hath regarde ſaluation procureth ſame ſhewing himſelfe rough towards v cannot abyde ſhould louing father v ſhoulde handle v tenderly wee abuſe goodneſſe continually therefore hee fayne make v feele diſpleaſure elſe wee ſhoulde vtterly periſhe effect whiche eliu ment ſay nowe well put vre truely would peyne v bliſſe god name oure aduerſitie ſteade wee gnaſhe teeth euery v ſtormeth thinketh god dooth v wrong elſe conceyue ſuche bitterneſſe heart ſhet vp cannot conſider ſinnes ſhoulde bee gentle meeke take pleaſure minding god graciouſe goodneſſe although confeſſe doctrine true yet commeth putting vre ſhew ſtill well wee haue quite forgotten yet notwithſtanding without cauſe holy ghoſt doth ſo often laye afore v bring remembrance god ſhewing himſelfe angrie v bycauſe hee loueth v ſhould alwayes ſhewe v louing countenaunce woulde ouerthrowe v deſtroy v therefore behooueth v feele anger effectually neuertheleſſe ſame record goodneſſe meane whereby calleth v intent wee ſhould follow way deſtruction whereinto wee entred lo howe wee ought bee put minde ende marke whereat god ameth ſcourgeth v heerewithall wee wained agayne howe ſtubborne nature ſhame whereas woulde handle v gently dandle v lappe wee ſpurne feete ſcratch ſhorte cannot away ſuch goodneſſe gentleneſſe woulde readie vſe continually towards v ſayde ſlauiſh churliſhe nature truely scripture auoucheth god nature gentle long ſuffering louing beare weake ſhewe mercie although men haue offended seing ſo ſurely hee transformeth himſelfe ſorte followeth owne nature chaſtizeth v ſheweth himſelfe hard ſharpe towards v neuertheleſſe fayne vſe ſuche roughneſſe reaſon oure wilfull ſtubbornneſſe bycauſe wilde beaſts ſling ſo farre ſquare woulde gather v gently home himſelf fall biting kicking againſt therefore behooueth v thinke vppon owne frowardneſſe ofte god vſeth rigoure towards v therewithall muſt alſo take comfort aduerſities foraſmuche wee ſee god doeth neuer forget mercie ſomuche euen hee ſeemeth full minded thunder downe vppon v hee ſtriketh v one hande ſo ſetteth v vp agayne ſend v graue lift v vp afterward aboue heauens seing god doth middes anger ſhew v goodneſſe yeelde v record haue wee wherewith comforte ſelues comforte ought hand ingender quietneſſe cōſcience afrayde god rigour thinke hee deſtroy v vnpoſsible ſhoulde bee pacient contrariwiſe alſo ſeing god ſheweth v hee minded deſtroy v vtterly father v flee refuge repayre humilitie ſame ought rid heart rebelliouſneſſe bitterneſſe make v ſubmit ourſelues obeyſance ſo wee may ſay lorde • itl thou art ſo good mee ſuffer ſtriue againſt thy hand ſpecially ſeing ſo fatherly thus ye ſee ende may bee comforted affliction behoueth v yeelde ſelues ſubiection vnto god hee may gouerne v thinke well iuſtice ende wee kindle fire wrath thorough rebelliouſneſſe hath bene ſayde afore ſayde purpoſely ende god vtterly ouerthrowe conſume abilitie ſerueth abate men pryde needes ſtrengthen themſelues continually againſt god hand cauſe eliu addeth ſhallbee raunſoming wee may well bring great preſents yet ſhall nother gold ſiluer able deliuer v hande god rather ſame ſhall bee occaſion deſtroy v muſte vnderſtande god intendeth abate men aduauncing themſelues agaynſte one man riche another good credite third good eſtimation woorſhippe make bulwarkes theſe thing agaynſt god thinke ourſelues well ynough ſenced withſtande hande wee haue fooliſhe conceyte yet alwayes bee ſome blockiſhneſſe v vntill ſuch time men brought nothing ſo knowe nother ſtrength ought elſe thinke themſelues able withſtand god vvhat done let v learne abilitie leſſe nothing ſpeciallye wee haue deale god hee blowe vppon vvee may well gather togither ſtrength worlde onely whiche might one man yea though ſtrōgeſt euer alſo ſtrength creature aboue beneath yet ſhall bee nothing woorth wee haue hande god agaynſte v therefore let v marke wel humble ourſelues god muſt diſpatch away vayne preſumptuouſneſſe thinke wee haue thing remayning v ſomuch although thinke haue ſome courage ſtrength v time yet behoueth v know ſame ſmoke pleaſe god conſume v therevpon let v returne vnto god praying giue v abilitie power ſay make v reſt alwayes vpon knowing hold life appurtenance thereof free goodneſſe thus ye ſee haue marke ſtreyne ſayd god destroy men abilitie ſhallbee conſumed notwithstanding theyr ſtrength wheras ſayde ſhal raunſoming ſerueth ex • peſſe better thing come ſay although men graunte nother gold ſiluer able raunſome man •• god yet ſee fall aſleepe ryches credit ſuch thing haue graunted cannot withſtande god yet make bulwarkes thoughe able beate backe harmes ſo fight agaynſt god ſo whence commeth ſuche preſumptuouſneſſe beholde woorme earth carion rottenneſſe aduaunceth ſelfe againſt god muſt needes bee horrible beaſtly blockiſhneſſe yes ſurely specially man riche ſo hee thinketh hee hath wote bee eſteemed hee would purchace himſelf eſtimation vaunting himſelfe ſo farre lifte vp himſelfe againſt god although hee ſpeake one woorde yet ſo doted beareth himſelfe hand gold ſiluer able deliuer muſte regarde men confeſſe mouthes wee muſte haue eye theyr dooings giue true proofe ſayde diueliſhe pryde namely truſting gold ſiluer ſteade putting good vſe gather ſuche pryde meanes therof fall iuſtling agaynſt god ſeeing ſo behoueth v thinke well therevpon holy ghoſt vſeth ſuperfluous ſpeache true firſte bluſhe may ſeeme needeleſſe tell v god regardeth nother golde ſiluer hee knoweth babe haue skill ſay muche yea meane whyle wiſeſt ſay take themſelues wiſeſt ſo counted among men ſo blinded euery turne beare themſelues hande may bought gold ſiluer vnder colour ſomewhat haue men feare honour yee ſhall ſee ſo beſotted take themſelues mortall men thinke god one moment ouerthrowe beleeued ſhoulde neuer haue ſayde diueliſh pryde exalting thēſelues faſhion agaynſt god nowe ſith ſo lette v learne profite ourſelues better god chaſtizements haue done furthermore although ſmyte vpon v yet let v haue wit fare better correction ſheweth eye god vſeth ſuch goodneſſe teach v mēs harm ſet ſuche chaſtizementes v may ſerue inſtruction therefore let v thinke vpon aduaunce ſelues agaynſt moreouer ſeeing wee cannot bring thing redeeme ſelues hand let v reſort raunſome hath giuen v perſone owne ſonne according alſo • peter telleth v bought gold ſiluer precious bloud vnſpotted lamb thus ye ſee poynt whervnto muſt come concluding texte knowe bereft meanes ſcape god hande ſhould neceſsitie vtterly cōſumed vſeth pitie towardes v muſt vnderſtande hath giuen v good remedie pleaſed offer vp onely sonne ſacrifize v wee fully raunſomed ſufficient diſcharge put away fault ſo diuell ſhall haue intereſt v although ouerwhelmed infinite multitude ſinnes yet notwithſtanding bloude ieſus chriſt anſwere v ſufficient ſatisfaction offence inough appeaſe wrath god ye ſee whervnto refuge muſt cannot come bloud ieſus chriſt vntill bereft ſtatelineſſe wel paſt come paſte ende may conſider ſhould vtterly periſh ſinne quite cleane ouerwhelmed god giuen v meane purged bloud sonne come end caryed away ſuch rage lift vp ſelues againſt god though could ſcape hande rather holde ſelues ſuche awe euen willing minde wee looke god ſhoulde cheyne v vp like wilde beaſtes euery v may bridle himſelfe owne accorde let v haue ſuche modeſtie v attempt thing againſt whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe chaſtize v let euery v thinke thus himſelf go god chaſtiſeth ſuch ſinne ſuch maner behoueth mee make profit therfore let v deafe god warneth v faſhion let v looke narrowly ſelues bee watchfull according example giueth v intent grow paſt grace ſo thing befall v ſpoken heretofore namely heape vp continually greater wrath horrible vengeance god vpon v let v fall face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying giue v ſuch repentance may reſort wholly vnto ſubmitte ſelues fully guyding holy ſpirite wee may walke rightly according good ſuch wiſe name may glorified v life long ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father c cxlij sermon fourth vpon xxxvj chapter 20 conſume night roote people vnder 21 keepe thee turning iniquitie thou haſt chozen rather affliction 22 behold god exalteth povver vvho like teache 23 vvhome hath ſet ouer vvayes hath ouerlooked way vvho ſhall ſay vnto thou haſt done amiſſe 24 remember thou magnifie vvorke vvhich men beholde knowe good profitable thing thinke vpō god work alſo thing whence muſte fetch oure learning wiſdome whole life ſpeciallye night time whē alone ſelues wee haue leyſure occupyed applying mind ſtudy ouerpaſſe thing ſee day time night thinke vpon thē leyſure ſettledneſſe cōprehēd better neuertheleſſe muſt keepe meaſure muſing vpon god work wit high v paſſe reache vnderſtanding wee muſte ſtoppe glorifie ſpecially pleaſeth conceale reaſon doings v cauſe ſayeth text must ſpende night muſing muche bowe people rooted vnder good ſeeke howe god rooteth nation end learne humilitie behoueth v reaſon wiſe namely god paſſe deſtroy whole countrie inhabiters thereof ſhall become one poore man shall one man proude thinke haue euerlaſting ſtate whē ſetteth eye god ſweepeth away great multitude people minute houre ye ſee profitable compariſon god ſpare whole countrie haue offended ſhall become mee knoweth exceeding great number ſinnes wretched creature furthermore ſhall haue muzed vpon ſuch thing mind troubled amazed reaſon ſundry doubt come heades able reſolue haue elſe holde ſelues within ſuch ſobrietie reuerence god iudgements although comprehend therefore behoueth v take good heede god work yet muſt beware ouerſhoot ſelues making lōg depe ſearch cauſe forbidden text conſume ſwallowe vp night marke one poynte furthermore let v marke wheras ſaid people rooted vnder magnifie god power cauſeth mē ſinke bottomleſſe pitte ſame place ſhall haue giuen thē dwell whole nacion driuen eye cō ueyed ſome far countrie continued ſtill ſame matter make v wonder ſo much ſuddeine change come world ſeeme god maketh mē melt away like ſnow dede ſee ſome countrie hath bin well peopled day layd waſte vvhat become inhabiters true ſcartered yet remēbrance razed foraſmuch man cannot poynt know become thus ye ſee imported ſentence ſayd nacions ſhall rooted place vnder foote though earth opened ſwalowed vp ſo man might perceiue print path vvhen god worketh faſhiō wonderfuller thing people remoued place place ſeene god diſlodgeth whole countrie giue new dwelling hereby warned conſidering god iudgementes wee muſte looke hygher owne wittes reach vnto cauſe feare god ſo much wee ought yet notwithſtanding wee diminiſhe power fearing highneſſe whiche ought make v afrayde therfore oft ſet mindes conſidering god iudgements executeth world let v learn conſider ourſelues high thing v haue throughly thought vpon muſt faine ſtop ſhort wittes reach ſo far wide▪ beſides heere alſo one good admonition god needeth vſe inferiour viſible meanes hee liſte conſume v ſtande faſteſt hee make v melte away earth beareth v day ſhall fayle v tomorrow although haue none enimy aſſaile v although god ſende greate army agaynſt v truly nedeth giue v one angry looke ſhall conſumed yea euen without putting hande vnto v hee ſhall neede chaunge place hee ſhall neede remoue v farre hee ſhall neede caſte v downe breake neckes ſtand ſureſt vpon feete ſeeme beſt able hold ourſelues good plight euen ſhall ſooneſt periſhe god agaynſt v man ſhall able rid v hande seeing tolde v lette v learne humble ourſelues haue foundacion ſouereyne power aboue foraſmuch god promiſeth reache v hand let v truſte therevnto referre ſelues wholly vnto therewithall acknowledging oure owne vanitie vnſufficiencie end puffed vp preſumption maketh v drunken thus ye ſee effect haue beare away verſe ſayde immediatly keepe thee turning iniquitie thou baste chozen rather affliction elſe bycauſe affliction hebrew woorde manner ſpeach importeth twayne firſt formoſt iob warned hee ſhoulde turne euill vnder terme wee meene eyther robberie murther ſpitefulneſſe ſuche like thing vnderſtande hartburnings againſte god grudgings rebellings proceede impaciencie cauſe ſayd lob muſt keepe himſelfe turning vnto euill ſhewed himſelfe bee pacientynough ſubmitting himſelfe vnto god acknowledging rightuouſneſſe time aduerſitie purpoſely ſayd vnto ſhould ſtand vpon gard harde thing forbeare falling pinched aduerſitie agayne looke ſayde vnto iob ought ſerue v ſo let v take ſaying exhortatiō holy ghoſts v al cōmon ſhould watchfull whē bee afflicted ſo ſwarue aſide vnto euill vvhat reaſon aſſoone god hand toucheth v greued meaſure needeth put v patience specially affliction greate violent vtterly diſmayd ſtoutneſſe ſoeuer v afore whereas man would haue thought v inuincible bee quite hart wote become seeing ſuch frailtie v ſtandeth v hande looke well ſelues doo indeuer holde faſt good yea verily although man ſtreyne himſelfe vttermoſt yet ſhall hee haue much ado ſtande hee ſtumble ſome meanes yet notwithſtanding wee haue cauſe bee good cheere forſomuch ſee ſpirite god conſidereth howe hard battels wee labour keepe ſelues euill let v doubt god holde v vp euen ſeeth v laſt caſt wee holde inforce ourſelues therevnto although bee feebleneſſe wee dutie full yet god accept paynes indure take good woorth beholde thing ought giue v courage yet muſt diligent behalf according ſhewed v therefore let v flatter ſelues ſticke wee turne aſide vnto euill ſay ouermuch greeued god beateth v roddes ſay let v labour keepe ſelues ſtriuing agaynſt wee murmure iuſtice haue ſeene heretofore extreeme wickedneſſe men lift vp themſelues ſort agaynſt god ſo ſtubborne cannot thinke well doings glorifie ſame although appeare bee ſuch euill iudgement men yet doth god eſteeme moſt heynous crime without cauſe vvherefore oft wee feele aduerſitie let v looke well ſelues quiet ſubmit ſelues wholy vnto god thing eliu ſheweth euidently hee addeth iob bad chozen euill rather affliction bycauſe affliction theſe tranſlations tende one ende iob bare cace peaſably humbling himſelfe lyfted vp himſelf agaynſt god affliction conſidered behoued haue ſtouped vnder hande hilde power man aske howe iob condemned ſuch ſturdineſſe ſeeing ſet v myrrour pacientneſſe haue anſwered queſtion already namely god accepted pacient certeſſe vertue commended onely recorde mortall men alſo recorde holy ghoſt yet notwithſtanding let hee imperfection amiſſe ſome reſpect iob hauing indeuered himſelfe bee quiet hee might glorifie god knowe publiſh mightie power blamed neuertheleſſe pray ſhall become v make compariſon betweene pacientneſſe hartburnings repinings v wee ſo coy god ticke v little finger pelting chafe nothing elſe v murmuring ſpyting seeing bee ſo farre vertue iob deſerue hundred time condemned hee therefore let v vnderſtande firſt although affliction bee ſent v tame v withall yet doth ſtirre v rebelling agaynſt god owne nature bycauſe ſinfulneſſe vvhen god chaſtizeth v end deale better v according ſheweth v ſinnes intent condemning wee ſhould flee refuge hauing knowne iudge beſeech pardon grace learne delight ſooth oure ſelues oure vyces thus ye ſee end god chaſtizeth v turne affliction contrarie ſteade ſtouping vnder god hande nothing fret grinde teeth ſtorme ſhort wee cannot abide bee either poore ſicke ſuffer miſeryes worlde woulde faine god ſhoulde let v alone peace yea hee ſhoulde gouerne v owne fancie ought miſliking ſo reaſon affliction wee ſwarue aſide vnto euill seing ſuch frowardneſſe v meanes god ordeyneth holde v awe vnder obedience turned v cleane contrarie ſo much make v play wilde beaſtes chafe agaynſt kicke agaynſt spurre ſeeing ſay ſuch ſinfulneſſe v lette v learne reſiſt muche poſsible ſeeing iob hee could blamed haue chozen iniquitie affliction▪ let v conſider ſame much happen vnto v looke well v furthermore whereas ſayd rather affliction moſt conuenient fit tranſlation notwithſtanding ſayde come one end maner ſpeaking hath certaine grace whereof may gather inſtruction ſayde iob choze iniquitie rather affliction howe▪ vvhen man chafeth agaynſt god doeth hee therefore ſcape hande hee holdeth himſelfe aray aduerſitie ought make v ſtoupe wee fight agaynſt hande god true ſo vayne wee ſhall bee diſappoynted hope wee ſhall gayne nothing yet oft gnaſh teeth maner againſt god impaciencie meening poſſible bee ſubiect vnto god cauſe ſayde ſaying importeth good doctrine perceyued throughly ſuch yeelde meekely vnto aduerſitie loth ſubiect vnto god coulde finde harte beate backe force wee woulde abhorre impacientneſſe muche yea would thinke intolerable blaſphemie wee ſticke chafe turmoyle god hande vppon v token bee acquainted ſayd text namely ſuch vnpacient loth bee ſubiect vnto god woulde fayne haue ſoueraintie authoritie aboliſhed hee hath ouer thing ought put v minde pacient haue bene wont whenſoeuer pleaſeth god frame v humilitie eliu addeth god exalteth power like teaching ſuch lawmaker hee otherſome tranſlate hee ruſheth casteth forth doth hebrew worde betokeneth alſo cast throw neuertheleſſe proceſſe text ſheweth foraſmuch god wiſedome treated better take woorde • teach taske men lawe doctrine according worde betokeneth moſt commonly nowe behoueth v take ſentence firſt maner god bath like teaching referred ſimply woorde god alſo inwarde power god vttereth pleaſeth touch v quicke pierce hart ſuch wiſe come truly whenſoeuer god woorde preached men reade holy scripture god teacher go ſchoole may wel ſayd teaching like vnto ſhall haue bene taught men life long yet ſhall nothing vanitie v vntill grounded wiſedome god bicauſe ſubſtantialneſſe thing vaniſhe quite away good fayth wiſe men worlde neuer ſo highly learned ſharpe witted yet vnderſtanding darkened continually ſome cloudes ſo much certaintie euer newe ſeeke much ſayd ſuch taught men therefore verie true ſaying teacher like vnto god ſhall neuer taught perfectly till haue knowne worde god eliu procedeth yet wit taught god pleaſeth touch harte inwardly holy ſpirite hee woorketh ſuch ſort wee knowe maieſtie obey ſame creature founde peculiar office god holye ſpirite yea reſerueth wholly himſelfe experience ſheweth hee onely worthie prayſe though wee ſhould reade holy scripture continually without ceaſsing expounded v men excellent skill great cunning yet ſhoulde labour vnauaylable ſhall profite nothing vntill god inlighten v holy ſpirite touch hart ſoften perce eares hath bene ſeene heretofore open eye ſo harte hard flint may turned fleſh bow vnto obedience vntill ſuch time god ſhal purpoſe men ſpeake v teaching ſlip vaniſhe away v yet ſhall neuer bee able take roote mindes therefore without cauſe tolde v heere teacher like vnto god furthermore ſayd onely ende wee ſhoulde repayre vnto bee rightly taught alſo ende ſhould learne ſelfwiſe diſcourſes imagination conceiue next way ſhet ſelues oute doore wee might come god ſchoole vvhat done let v learne vtterly ignorant till lord haue taught v morouer let v cōtent ſelues knowledge haue learned hande whatſoeuer elſe commeth head let v thruſt vnder foote aſſuring ſelues euery whit leaſing falſehood thus ye ſee eliu ment ſtreyne alſo cauſe ſayeth beholde god exalteth aduaunceth power heereby ſheweth god worke v muſt go knowe vttermoſt thing doth may trie workes men inaſmuch wee haue eye wee beholde looke euery corner alſo able handle hand toſſe turne oure pleaſure ſo wyth workes god exalteth power ſay hee woonderfull doings therefore men muſt attempt preace ſo farre ſearch vttermoſt doings iudge aduenture giue bridle raſhneſſe comprehend seeing god woorkes ſo high proceede infinite power behoueth v alſo ſtay wee bee couched heere lowe great diſtance betweene v cannot flie ſo high vvherefore let v holde v contented god ſendeth ſuffer ſelues bee gouerned holy ſpirite neither couet deſire knowe thing ſaue ſhall haue ſhewed v ſhort let v ſcholers aſſuring ſelues wiſedome conſiſteth brideling owne fancy ſo raunge abroade nowe wee ſee meening eliu therefore better confirming matter haue dealt heretofore let v follow ſayd admonition hath bene ſayde good thing apply minde conſidering god woorkes ſo bee wee deale ſoberly acknowledging ſlenderneſſe owne vnderſtanding therefore whereas ſayd god exalteth power let v vnderſtand hee intendeth let v wander owne liking therfore let v ſo proudas ſay workes eſteemed men workes let v aſſure ſelues haue men magnifie honour furthermore foraſmuch wiſedome fayleth v yet notwithſtanding fleſhe tempteth tickleth v deſirous ſeeke lawfull v know let v beare minde none like god teaching therfore behoueth v come ende may inlighten v mindes may bee gouerned hande direction vvhen taught ſchoole wee ſhall profite ynough god workes therewithall wee ſhall haue wherewith barre owne curioſities vndoubtedly behoueth v alwayes watchfull may reſtrayne ſelues although faythfull bee modeſt framed long aforehande receyue inſtruction god hande yet notwithſtanding ſtill ſome curioſities flittering head ſo haled away many imagination come mind cauſing ſay let v alwayes come backe concluſion forſomuch able comprehend god woorkes creature elſe power behoueth v come vnto hee muſte onely teache v woorde alſo inlighten v order thought bring v vnder lure holde v fully awe thus yee ſee effect wee haue remember ſentence ſayde anon ſhall ouerſee way ſhall ſay thou hast done amiſſe elſe hath ſet ouer way hebrue worde ſignifieth giue preheminence lordſhip ſometime viſite ouerſee neuertheleſſe meening eliu euident inough namely mortal creature controll god make ſearch finde fault doings blame though miſaduiſed knewe howe order thing ſhould bee ſumme conteyned intent wee may gather familiar doctrine ſentence let v ſet downe grounde men muſte bee iudged god haue authoritie bee iudges ouer thing ſhewed v heere theſe woordes eliu vſeth vvill wee iudge god high treaſon wee vſurpe written knee ſhall bowe come iudgement ſeate saint paule declareth fourtenth romanes seeing god reſerueth iudging v himſelfe alone remayneth v abſteyne diueliſh boldneſſe deſiring ſo control ſtriue againſt though fault bee founde doings hee blamewoorthie wee ſome better diſcretion skill hee nowe well put vre ſhould ſee another maner modeſtie men lyke god whereas blaſphemies fluſh men mouthes wee ſhoulde heare god prayſes ſounde euerywhere ſo ſhoulde one agreeable melodie magnifie hys ineſtimable rightuouſneſſe wiſedome power goodneſſe although eueryman confeſſe firſt bluſh good reaſon god ſhoulde woorke ſuch maner man might aduaunce himſelfe agaynſt yet notwithſtanding men verie fewe refrayne ſuch pryde ſee themſelues inclined thereto nature therefore ſtandeth v hand holde faſt doctrine giuen v eliu rather holy ghoſt wee muſt bee mindefull magnifie god woorkes yea euen thoſe woorkes knowne men nowe eliu hath ſayde man reproue god workes telleth v wee must remember magnifie length ſhall finde men bee conuinced experience god dooth thing vprightneſſe equitie therefore lette v conſider mindes may reſtreyned end wee fall ſtraying gadding ouer fieldes behoueth v ioyne theſe two ſentences togither matched firſt hee ſay vnto god thou haſt done amiſſe wee muſt remember magnifie truely moſte menne well ynough preſume ſo farre accuſe god miſdealing deede man ſhall heare nothing grudgings agaynſt god although hee vpright poynts yet men ceaſſe finde fault yet bee able reach vnto cauſe eliu ſcorneth fooliſh ouerweening hee ſayeth man able charge god miſdealing men may well ſpewe blaſphemies yet ſhall vaniſh ſhed away like water meane god ſhall continue perfect ſtate ſtill laugh ſuch preſumptuouſneſſe menne ſcorne needes ruſhe maner agaynſt let v marke well ſuch hold themſelues ſuch modeſtie haue ſhewed ought ſhall auaile haue replied neuer ſo much againſt god hee hath ſet perſone ouer himſelfe herein ſhewed v men ouerfooliſhe diſtitute reaſon diſpute ſo agaynſt god vvhy hath ſet ſuch office man ſhoulde take vpon iudge thoſe ouer whome hath authoritie ſet taskes tallages vpon giue ſentence vpon doings woulde world thinke well ſuch preſumptuouſneſſe would take ſuch man ſtarke foole wee bee farre fonde lifting vp ſelues agaynſt god poore begger ſhoulde giue away dukedomes lordſhips appoynt iudges lieutenantes countrie euerie man woulde laugh ſcorne much wee take vpon v rule god giue leſſon preſumptuouſneſſe wee would take hande ſubdue prince lure ſo great furious ſtatelineſſe nowe eliu ſheweth wee tempted iudge ouerhaſtily god woorkes reaſon wexe bolde prowde muſt come poynt ſay vvhat thing throughly conſidered meere v looke vnto god controll ſpie doings finde faulte haue paſſed handes haue ouerſight v examine wayes wee fully reſolued poynt bee ynough barre curious queſtions hold v awe ſhort behoueth v conclude god ſhewing workes vnto v end vnder thē ſhould looke vpon conſider ſayde heere hee ſhall ouerſee ouerlooke ſaying importeth much two ſortes looking vpon god woorkes one perceyue owne ſmalneſſe acknowledging wee creepe bylow lift vp mind aloft fayth aſſuring ſelues bee able comprehende ſo high profound ſecrets bee ſhort fayth matched lowlineſſe honouring thing vnknowne v thus yee ſee one good maner looking vpon god workes vnder therfore ſo lowly meeke harted hauing conſidered owne meaſure lift vp heades caſt vp eye deſiring reuerently knowe pleaſeth god ſhew v looke vppon god woorkes vnder contrarywiſe ſayde text ſhall ouerlooke looke aboue wayes lo contrarie way looking men aduaunce themſelues mount aboue ergoes deſire ouerlooke god workes though ſame vnder mount maner muſte needes breake neckes maner ladder haue againe let v labour much wee vaine imagination certaine wee ſhall haue foundation beare v vp vntowarde curſed faſhion looking vpon god woorkes men ſteppe though would thruſt doings vnder feete call account ſit iudgement vppon thoughe ſuperioritie ouerrule let v keepe v ſuch diueliſhe pryde added appurtenance wee muſt remember magnifie god workes ſeconde ſentence ſayde bee matched former one ſayd wee must remember ſeemeth eliu might haue ſayde one worde magnifie thou workes god ſayth remember thou vvhy ſo bee willingly occupied owne wicked imagination hinder v yeelding god deſerued due glorie therefore ſtandeth v hande quicken vp remembrance minde ſeeing ſo forgetfull god example vvhen ſhould thinke vpon god firſt thing come thought ſhal ſome illuſion satan make v fall rage caſt v diſpayre ſnarle v ſome diſtruſt elſe make v tumble deſtruction ye ſee wittes ouerwrapped ſuch ignorance thinke vpon god meanewhile satan wilie ynough put ſome wicked fancie head turne v away god poſsible true many men know meaneth vtterly blockiſh knowe warned bethinke diſeaſe rooted men foraſmuchas wee may bee tempted wicked conceyts therefore ſayde wee muſt bethinke ſelues ſuffer god buried call remembrance god himſelfe hath printed men wit creature muſte exalt hymſelfe agaynſt maker ſame muſte ſerue v brydle holde affection captiuitie thruſt vnder foote ſo wee may ſay wretched creature art thou commeſt thou heere diſpute agaynſt thy god ſubdue reaſon thou ſhouldeſt take vpon thee controll make paſſe vnder thy hande malapertneſſe men enter intoo ſuche examination themſelues driue away lewde imagination come mindes hinderance magnifie god workes becommeth therefore let v beware diuell put lewde conceytes heades let v warde farre magnifying god workes bee woorthie howe ſhall wee magnifie iudging owne knowledge wee muſte honour although paſſe reach although wee perceyue reaſon bee done yet let v ceaſſe ſay lorde thou art iuſt▪ rightuous full equitie thus yee ſee thing wherein wee muſt occupie ſelues tyme oure life knowe greatneſſe excellencie god workes ſuch cannot yeelde ſuch prayſe deſerue without aduauncing aboue ourſelues eliu alſo ſayeth expreſſely men know v wit menne haue fought fill agaynſt god according ſee pryde alwayes v yet end muſt needes ouercome god peraduenture ſuffer v inquire vnaduizedly wee haue ſo giuen brydle fleſhly luſtes satan hath caried v away fooliſhe affection ende wee ſhall perceyue late god rightuous ſhall continue ſo ſpyte teeth ſeing experience ſheweth god workes deſerue prayſe done shall wee take vpon v inquire doings vttermoſt let v ſhunne let v rather learne honour humilitie ſo yeelde rightuouſneſſe deſerueth confeſſe wiſedome iuſtice goodneſſe mightineſſe appeare ſuch wiſe workes muſt needes knowne ſuch one wit moſt louing father towardes thoſe iuſt iudge towardes thoſe hath forſaken let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement faultes praying ſo touch v wee may vtterly condemne ourſelues namely ende wee may bee acquit mercie therwithall may alſo pleaſe remedie vice v ſo clenze v may draw neerer neerer heauenly life foraſmuch wee bee ſo much inclined pryde preſumption cannot bow vnder requiſite let v pray graunt v grace ſubmit ourſelues humilitie feare ſo may fit receyue inſtruction woorde holy ſpirit intent poynts reſpects wee may yeelde due honor guide v obedient child vnder gouernment father may pleaſe graunt grace c cxliij sermon fifth vpon xxxvj chapter 25 men behold euery man ſeeth farre 26 behold god great number yeares knovvne counting 27 hee reſtrayneth droppes vvater aftervvarde maketh raine moyſture poure dovvne 28 maketh come heauen ſheadeth dovvvne vpon multitude men 29 vvho knovv diuerſitie clovvdes vvhat heape tent 30 ſtretcheth light couereth rootes sea 31 doth execute iuſtice vpon people giue abundance vvherevvith liue 32 clotheth drie ſtreames vvith clovvdes commaundeth go agaynſt 33 companion brings tidings ſtrife anger mounting vp wee haue beare minde matter glaunced yeſterday namely ſhewed v heere although men woulde ſhet eies yet bring paſſe god ſhoulde ſet himſelfe afore work ſhould knowne hereby warned man knowe god ſame commeth ſimple ignorance rather ſtubborne wilfulneſſe bycauſe hee turneth away haue ſayde afore god workes manifeſt vnto v ſhew themſelues euery therefore bee ignorant except liſt ourſelues reſpect whereof ſayde men beholde farre ſimilitude importeth bee ſo excellent ſuch greatneſſe maieſtie although farre diſtance betwene v yet able ſee vve knowe man farre v eye ſight reach thither fadeth way bee great caſtell ſeeme little cabban looke farre whole towne wil ſeeme two three houſes thus doth farre diſtance diminiſh outwarde appearance thing great wee ſee neere hande vve haue experience ynough sunne ſeemeth bee ſcarcely two foote broade yet notwithſtanding man knowe reaſon thing philoſophers thoſe acquainted ſecretes nature ſhew ſhall perceyue sunne much greater whole earth ſayde expreſly men beholde god workes farre farre farre eye ſight muſt needes vtterly dazeled yet farre perceyue god worketh therefore followeth ſuch maieſtie god woorkes wee ought duetie honour therein nowe let v marke ſuch glorifie god ſhould cloke themſelues ignorance vaine couert bicauſe work cannot knowne vnto thē ſo muche wee alledge eye ſight weake god working high v replyed although god woorkes nigh v yet wee ceaſſe perceyue ſo farre forth needefull magnifying although eyeſight verie feeble yet ſuch greatneſſe excellencie worthineſſe god woorkes wee haue ſome inckling therfore let v lerne apply mindes knowing thing god ſheweth v furthermore let v marke alſo behoueth v know god workes according owne meaſure ſhew himſelf farre let v content ourſelues therewith true may well deſire haue come neere v part alſo behoueth v ſtreyne ſelues day day haue familiar full knowledge workes yet muſt walke humilitie god liſt bee knowne full onely part let v holde ſelues pleaſeth meane ſayde let v play purblind ſtarkblind buſſards wilfully let v ſuffer god ſhew himſelfe v hath ſhewed himſelfe wee knowe let v honor yeeld deſerued prayſe nowe herewithall eliu ſayth bycauſe god great knowe neither numbring accounting yea • e ſentence ſhoulde ſeeme rep • gne haue ſayd alreadie know know thing vtterly contrary vve ſaw laſt verſe although god far v yet notwithſtanding workes ſo great ſee ſayde god cannot knowne knowing ſpoken ment cannot comprehende god ſuch wiſe maieſtie wee come farre ſhort ynough v wee haue ſome little taſte able comprehend infinite light ſuffizeth wee haue ſome little ſparkes therof thus ye ſee wiſe god knowne namely capacitie ſmall conceyue comprehend yet notwithſtanding meening vtterly hid frō men ſheweth himſelf inough honoured handes therfore knowledge haue god bee able determine ſay throughly yet neuertheleſſe vnexcuſable wee honour forſomuch hath ſhewed himſelfe ſuch portion vnto v hee knoweth v able beare profite ſee maner beholde god howe may knowne v wit looking glaſſe claddeth himſelfe viſible maieſtie ſeene heauen earth lo wize ought looked vpon cauſe ſayd creature ſeate thoſe ornament prince appareleth himſelfe royaltie haue reuerence euen ſo god ornament heauen earth muſt looked vpon ſubſtance inuiſible hidden v vttereth vertues ſuche wyſe although wee blind yet might grope according alſo paule vſeth ſame ſimilitude 17 actes seeing ſo let v learne ſee god conſider workes mightie power appeereth ſheweth v deſerueth well bee glorifyed handes yet muſt wee preſume knowe perfectly ſo ſhould able define glory paſſeth vnderſtanding wee muſt caſt downe eye confeſſe hee dwelleth vnapprochable light therefore knowing god part therewithall behoueth v confeſſe bee ſo ignorant weake ynough v haue ſome taſt god maieſtie muſt holde ourſelues ſtay ſith ſee wit fayle v good forlorne ſay behoueth v holde ourſelues within owne ſlenderneſſe praying god rid v mortall fleſh intent may behold become like vnto ſayd iohn furthermore wayting day reforme v preſently owne image end may beholde better thereafter god clenſeth v fleſhly vice heauie droſſe wee feele ourſelues ſo maketh hee v meeter beholde ſo vpon knowledge weakeneſſe owne wittes haue pray vnto god reforme v ende wee may profite increaſe knowledge vvheras mention made numbering yeares whereas ſayd cannot reckned truely man may thinke rude geere firſt bluſhe inaſmuch god beginning needeth bee ſayde euerlaſtingneſſe yeares thereof cannot bee reckned therefore ſaying might ſeeme ſuperfluous wee conſider eliu amed wee ſhall finde ſaying greatly profite haue ſayde heretofore men ſo caried away pride find fault god doings needes controll whereof commeth ſuch ſaucineſſe effect think themſelues wizer god nowe beate downe ſuch ouerweening ſayd man cannot recken number god yeares therfore whenſoeuer would iudges ouer tempted ſayde preſumptuouſneſſe deſire mount higher becō meth v lawfull v lette v bethinke ſelues thus wretched creature thou ſnayle paſt three dayes ago ſince thou cameſt firſt vpon earth meene euen liued foure fiueſcore yeares yet thou wilt take vpon thee iudge thy god plight art thou thou ſhalt haue reached verie creation worlde nothing compariſon euerlaſtingneſſe thou ſeeſt nowe thine owne follie thou art thy wittes thou entereſt ſuch maze go aboute iudge therefore let v learne told v god age endleſſe muſte alſo compare ſhortneſſe life according warned knowe tranſitorie ſlippe away like ſhadowe muſt compare ſayde ſhortneſſe life endleſſe time god euerlaſtingneſſe hathe neither time bound wil ſerue well keepe v aduauncing ſelues ſuch preſumption wee haue bene woonted thus wee ſee effect eliu telleth v muſt come declaratiō ſayeth concerning god workes hee alledgeth raine thunder vapour ſuch like thing hayle tempeſts whirlewinds vvhen wee ſee thoſe thing god giueth v ſuche ſignes maieſtie wee muſt needes honour elſe wee bee vnthankfull blockiſh true god hathe woorkes higher harder comprehende theſe intent holy ghoſt teach v groſſely according rudeneſſe homelineſſe therfore eliu ſetteth example work nature ſay common vvee neede go ſchoole great clerkes haue knowledge rayne hayle faire weather chaunges ſee ayre true reaſons verie common ordinarie man ſhould aske poore ſillie ſoule raine ingendred could reſolue bicauſe wee ſee howe water mounteth vp alſo howe water bee ingendred ayre might ſeeme thing agaynſt reaſon playne countryman cannot diſcuſſe thing knowne philoſophie howe rayne ingendered drawing vppe vapour ſteames ſo much sunne ſtryk • th vpon earth foraſmuch earth full hole ſo cloſe ſhet little vaines draweth vp vapour aloft little little become thicke middes ayre ingender rayne meanes moyſtures drawne vp little little vntil al thē grow ripe giue v raine againe countryfolke vnderſtand wherof commeth paſſe ſo great heate middle roome ayre although ſame neerer sunne cauſe heate ſetteth ſelf vpō earth vpon harth whereas ayre ſpreadeth abroade ſuch wiſe cannot reſt cauſe hayle ingendred ſee ſtraunge matter ſo much would hardly beleeue common thing among v hayle ſhould thicken ayre although sunne neerer therevnto v yet notwithſtanding ſee muſt needes bee great coldneſſe ignorant therefore haue knowledge theſe thing neither find oute reaſon amazed howbeit although wee knowe reaſon yet thing ſelfe ſufficiently knowne inſomuch appeareth drawing vp vapour earth maner ingendering raine afterwarde alſo holding raine ayre ingendered according ſayde clowdes bottels barrel tubbes woonderfull woorke god good ſooth barrelles ayre holde water notabler myracle ſee clowdes hanging ouer v vvhat letteth fall downe ouerwhelme v deſtroy earth muſte needes bee excellent power whereat wittes muſt amazed cauſe ſayde without going schoole without curious great booke learning man ſhal find ſufficient knowledge god workes order nature make vnexcuſable bycauſe ſame ſo common among v example wee looke vppon rayne hayle thunder ſuch like thing ſame ſhewe v certaine maieſtie god make v afrayde ſo wee muſt needes bee moued ſpyte teeth meanes lord inforceth v know maieſtie notwithſtanding vnthankfulneſſe indeuer quenche vttermoſt oure power ſee mention made vnto v raine ſuch like thing bicauſe god hath workes wonderfull excellent ende ſhould pretende ignorance holy ghoſt ſetteth v thing ſeene knowne whole world seing ſo haue wee worſhip god yeelding deſerued honor beate downe pride ſelues ſo learne ſubmit ſelues ordinance allow whatſoeuer doth diſpoſeth howbeit bee good mee expounde wordes gather generall doctrine ſayde god restrayneth holdeth backe droppes water ſerueth expreſſe better excellent power would beleeued men ſawe theyr eye man ſhould tel v droppes water hild vp ſay water ſo fine ſuttle thing ſheadeth ſoketh away hath faſtneſſe neuertheleſſe hild vp ayre notwithſtāding great number droppes greate quantitie would thinke ſtraunge experience water firme ſubſtantiall thing might well ſome mountayne god hold togither wheras hundred million drop one little clowde euery droppe nature readie fall away diſperſe reſt bodie ſoothly nothing ſheading ſlipperie water ſomuch looke many little portiōs ſo many diuiſions yet notwithſtanding hild togither knew perceyued wee would neuer beleeue muſt wee needes acknowledge infinite power god ſee thing could beleeued ſo eliu ſaying god holdeth togither droppes water ment expreſſe better mightie power god ſheweth v holding vp rayne ayre afterward ſayeth vapour maketh rayne man demaunde whereof rayne ingendered ſay nothing vapour owne ſelfe would ryze vp earth whiche hath hir ſteames within hir hole hir nature ryzing vp drawing ſunne whiche ſucketh vp moyſture hale vp high otherwiſe rope needed drawe vp vvere poſsible beleeue wee ſawe ſeene manifeſtly yee ſee vapour nothing ſay appeered ſight rize vpward againſt nature vp aloft rayne made faſhioned afterwarde earth moyſtened bringeth forth frute men take nurriſhment thereof behold lorde drieth earth drawyng vapour maner aſmuch man ſhoulde drawe ſappe iuice thing ſo ſhould leaue nomore ſtrength ye ſee withereth god findeth contrary meanes vvhen hath ſo dried earth drained bloud ſubſtance moyſteth agayne ſame ſee rayne giueth abundance frutes according ſhewed seing wee perceyue ſo muſte needes cōuicted maieſtie god would cōſider although ſhet eye yet doth god ſpite teeth ſhew himſelf v maieſtie viſible v ſortes immediatly declared god hath pauilions tent according wee know howe hath bene declared heretofore clowdes cope heauen termed god pauilions tent diuers time ſaid clowdes chariotes namely bicauſe guideth maketh go foreward elſe doth walke vpon make triumphes thus ye ſee god preſented vnto v prince vſeth heauen palace maieſtie ſheweth ſelfe agayne clowdes yee would ſay pillers pauilion ende wee ſhoulde moued conſider royall workemanſhip ſeing ſo let v learne yeeld god whiche owne let glorie defaced ou • vnthankfulneſſe moreouer nought whereas ſimilitude hath bene ſet downe already heretofore eliu repeteth yet know fooliſh curioſitie men needes behold god owne cannot much heede therefore muſt take theſe maner ſpeaches whiche agreeable infirmitie behold god viſible vnto v maner dwelleth palace wil preace vnto would know according capacitie cābeare let v go palace howbeit let v enter frentike boldneſſe comprehende god ſecretes ſeyng dwelleth palace muſt leaſtwiſe haue much power worldly king frayle creature let v content ſelues ſight excellent palace honour maieſtie pleaſe come neere vnto v behoueth v come reuerence paſſe bound behold ſay wee haue conſider maner ſpeach clowdes termed pillers god palace ſayd holde vp pauilion elſe ioyned parte ſerueth ſhewe ynough v taſte god maieſtie ſo farre foorth vttereth ſame v workes eliu ſpeaketh alſo effect rayne ſayeth god executeth iudgements vpon men giueth abundantly whereof liue vvherby meeneth god hee liſteth make rayne ſerue ſet forth goodneſſe ſo minde ſhew himſelfe foſterfather towardes men clowdes ſhall bring wherwith like prince intend ſuccour countrie ſuffereth famine appoynt menne bring victualles thither farre lande water euen ſo clowdes bring v god prouiſiō namely vttereth infinite goodneſſe towards v contrariwiſe purpoſeth ſhewe rigour cloudes execute vengeance vpon v vttereth diſpleaſure raynes outrageous doo great harme make ſuch flouds bothe hay corne ſwepte away moreouer follow waſtings alſo according diuerſe tymes ſeene sea drowneth greate countrey yee ſee howe god dooth rayne execute iuſtice alſo contrarie parte make v feele goodneſſe cauſe ſayde couereth rootes sea wee beholde rayne clowdes firſt brunt toucheth v maketh v afrayde meete alſo wee ſhoulde ſtricken ſome feare god withholdeth water ſo poure downe vppon worlde • e ſwallowe v vp firſt daſh maketh v perceyue god prouidence better wee ſee elius intent finally ſayeth god willmingle darkneſſe light togither sunne ſhineth commeth nowe ſuche ſodayne ſtorme menne abaſhed sommer tyme weather ſhall bee ſo calme fayre bee deuiſed turning hande ye ſhall ſee ſuch tempeſt ſhall ſeeme worlde ſhoulde go wrecke dooth muſt hee needes bee excellent maiſter commaundeth muſt excellencie god wonderful furthermore ſayde god commaundeth cloudes mount vp againe commaundeth fire aire ſay hee cōmaundeth ſteamings firie nature whote drie god commaundeth iuſtle agaynſt cloudes mount vpward therevpon followeth battell two army incountered togither mortall anger euen ſo incounter betwene cloudes drie gleames aboue anger theſe creature meete eche yee woulde ſay deadly foade doth need moſt god cōmaunder ſhould ſay done haphazard ſhould bee brutiſhe verie babe might laugh v ſcorne man hee knoweth god worketh herein ruleth aboue ye ſee thē effect wee haue gather wordes cheefeſt matter gather doctrine conteyned truely wordes right worthie bee well weyed intent may referred end haue touched howbeit way wee haue remember needeth great cunning proue vntoo v one god reigneth guideth worlde diſpoſeth order nature according owne vvhy ſo wee haue liued neuer ſo little worlde ſo wee haue ſeene raine three foure tymes beholde god yeeldeth v ſufficient recorde maieſtie ſo excuſe v wee ſhette eye ſpite teeth ſhall vnderſtande god ouerruleth thing ſee heere beneath thus ye ſee haue remember hereby wee ſee ſuch ſcoffe religion moued maieſtie god good bewitched satan ſayde wee neede haue gone ſchoole learne leſſon yet notwithſtanding men euen great skill thinke themſelues wiſe ynough deſpiſe god poſſible ſhould become ſo beaſtly ſayde bycauſe god hath vtterly giuen ouer bee ſo dulled satan raigneth yea euen ſuch darkneſſe bee worthie bee accounted men notwithſtanding let v marke therewithall haue alwayes ſore hartbytings although labour wipe knowledge god yet haue ſuch hartburning conſcience faine ſpite teeth feele maieſtie whiche woulde vtterly aboliſh cannot ſhift god muſt purſue ſhew himſelfe let v conclude thing conteyned ſeene experience men open eye muſt needes beholde maieſtie order nature although ſhet eye yet doth god make feele lo wee haue marke firſt place truly doctrine deſerueth layde large howbeit foraſmuch haue ſpoken heretofore ſufficeth call minde haue earſt declared without tarying long vpon way let v marke holy ghoſt doth ſet downe workes god beſt knowne men great ſmall intent vpon knowing euerie man ſhoulde take courage prayſe honour god knowe vvhy ſo maner teaching holy ſcripture curious high ſo none could faſten learned ſort woulde drawe backe moſt men would take occaſion ſay ala neuer went ſchoole god vouchſafeth ſhewe himſelfe learned men ſee god chaweth morſels v dreſſeth v like little child frameth himſelf rudeneſſe giuing v thing ſuche wiſe euen ſmalleſt ignoranteſt may haue part ſhare men terme pray ought wee take courage learne vnderſtande god comfort ſelues great goodneſſe ſheweth towards v hee ineſtimable care welfare hee woulde vouchſafe come downe ſo lowe ſith ſtoupe vnto v creature forſomuch hee ſeeing meete v ſheweth himſelfe v ſuch wiſe wee may conceyue perceyue wee therein howe much loueth v howe heprocureth ſaluation yee ſee haue beare minde therefore mention made vnto v raine cloudes vvhir lewindes haile let v imagine god could reaſon clearkly v lyſted gaue witte heathen philoſophers treate ſo well skilfully ſecretes nature god gaue knowledge meane teacheth v another faſhion hee haue men preach ſet forth doctrine ſaluation vnto v guide v owne kingdome hee haue onely make v king prince alſo liſt v vp aboue whole worlde make v fellowes angel mount aboue heauens aſmuche god intendeth lift v vp high commeth downe vnto v make v partaker benefites conteyned worde vvherfore let v learne deſpyſe holy scripture common thing let v vnderſtand god mind frame himſelfe infirmitie maner ye ſee wee haue marke heere withall let v learne alſo deſpiſe god workes bycauſe common among v vvhat cauſe eſteeme god doings myracle wee bee inured cuſtome ſee raine verie well moued whit cauſe ordinarie matter ſurely villaynous vnthankfulneſſe whereas god doth dayly woorke myracle ſhould dulled thereby thinke vpon although raine haile riſing tempeſts order nature ordinarie thing yet let v forbeare marke well thoſe thing conſider peacemeale lord layeth forth infinite treaſures power maieſ 〈…〉 end honored hand thus ye ſee wee haue beare minde howbeeit paſſe might demaunded purpoſe eliu alledgeth theſe thing ſeeing reaſoneth farre matter ſhewe god incomprehenſible dooings men muſt preſume ſtriue againſt mainteyne owne quarelles though rightfull god cruell afflicting ſeemeth nothing purpoſe haue reſolued queſtion alreadie onely ſay worde ſle • ghtly renue remembrāce thing hath bin ſpoken heeretofore length vvhich inferior thing ſet generally heere afore v make v mount vp higher god ſecrete incomprehenſible iudgements vvhen ſee raine clowdes ſtormes hayle ſurely naturall thing men terme ſerue this▪ tranſitorie life concerne worlde thing beneath yet notwithſtanding ſo cōfounded inforced reuerēce maieſtie god wee ſhall haue inquired poſsible thoſe thing done wittes fayle v remayneth nothing v humble ſelues god theſe ſmall lowe thing compell v honour god infirmitie bewrayeth ſelfe therein ſhall become v fall mounting aboue clowdes yea aboue sky wee come euerlaſting purpoſe god holdeth hiddē himſelf come point pray ſhall become mennes wittes may well flitter fiske man may ſooner breake necke hundred thouſande time attaine vnto god ye ſee manner elius teaching heere theſe thing ſeeme ſmall bycauſe cuſtome hath made common among vs▪ ſheweth god highneſſe ought duetie honoured handes wee ſhall neuer comprehende vve comprehende clowdes wittes miſſe ſee ſtriuing behalfagainſt god doings shall go ſet order clowdes ſay muſt bee ſo ſo tale tubbe raine ingendred vapour earth▪ sunne draweth vp thing heere beneath maner heate beames shal ſay ſtoppe god diſpozing thing according order hath ſet nature ala damnable outrage euerie man graunt ſeeing weakeneſſe ſheweth ſelfe theſe ſmall thing ryfe commō god ſetteth eye yet neuertheleſſe wee knowe behoueth v fall god worſhip confeſſe vnderſtanding nothing ſpecially ſith comprehendeth thing wee ſee day day much reaſon ſhould brydle wittes reyne ſhort wee come ſecrete determination iudgements hee executeth euerie day ſo common ryfe among v ſo diueliſhe pride man wil mount ſo high therefore muſt needes fall ſo vtter ruine neuer get vp againe let v kepe v ſtatelineſſe deſiring riſe vp againſt god namely ſecrete determination whiche ſurmount whole order nature thing able comprehende vnderſtanding effecte thing eliu looked amed nowe way let v marke ende knitting vp whereas ſayde god execute •• iudgements giueth men abundantly wherewith liue ende wee ſhoulde knowe order nature god hande ayre gouerned ſelfe raine commeth appoyntement sunne ſee contrarie effect beholde water drowneth men ſweepeth quite away againe mainteyneth yee ſee heere two contrarie woorkings nouriſhment one ſide waſting ſo god deſtroyeth ouerwhelmeth all▪ theſe twaine ſee cauſe thereof god ouerruleth thing aboue let v learne magnifie god wee ſee applie creature ſuch vſe hee thinketh good furthermore one ſide wee ſee rigour ſeeing hee myndeth puniſhe ſinnes wee ought conſider therein hee ſheweth himſelfe iudge ende wee ſhoulde condemne ſelues flee refuge mercie forſomuch vttereth treaſures goodneſſe ſheweth himſelfe liberall vvhich thing hee doth ſuch time declareth himſelfe haue care v ſending v prouiſion clowdes wherby maketh earth frutefull ende ſhould yeeld v ſuſtenance vvhen wee ſee ſide let v bee ſatisfyed goodneſſe god put whole truſt therein reſt therevpon concluding ſithe hee ſheweth himſelf father cheriſhing bodyes fraile carkeſſes much reaſon ſeeing hath faſhioned v anewe vnto owne glorie ſhould doubt charie ſaluation ſheweth himſelfe father reſt haue marke ſtreyne ſee god nowe applieth creature owne pleaſure vſing one ſyde roddes execute iuſtice otherſide making ſerue turne euen imploying releeue neceſsities preſent lyfe therefore let v beare theſe thing minde wee may bee taught feare reioyce reſt goodneſſe alſo ſettle truſt wholy vpon ſame nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v perceyue better haue done therewithall may knowe muſt miſlike ſelues ſtill ende correct ſinfulneſſe v foraſmuch hath pleaſed god drawe v alreadie vnto may conſider grace hee hath begonne v thervpon take courage go foreward ſtill till wee bee come perfection calleth v vnto neuer bee weary traueling thitherward meane ſeaſon wee may haue eye open behold goodneſſe power iuſtice wiſdome hee ſheweth v reforme v wholly obedience ſo may ſeeke nothing dedicate whole life ſeruice may pleaſe c cxliiij sermon firſt vpon xxxvij chapter alſo hart trembleth feare leapeth place 2 herken noiſe voice ſound mouthe 3 directeth vnder vvhole heauens light vpon vvings earth 4 againe brayeth vvith greate ſound thundereth vvith myghtie voice taryeth voice heard 5 god thundereth terribly vvith voice dooth vvonderfull thing vvhich man cannot comprehend 6 hee commandeth ſnowe fall dovvne vppon earth likevviſe ſvveete ſhovvers raynes greate force ſerueth leaſtwiſe whyle bee world wee ſhould haue eye open conſider woorkes god neere v eaſie bee ſeene though wee bee learned deepewitted folk euen verieſt idiot perceyue order nature ſuch ſee maieſtie god mirrour true ought lift vp ourſelues yet hygher conſider well god ſheweth v howbeit ſayd ought leaſt wiſe conſider thing preſent afore v notwithſtanding ynough vnderſtand god hauing created world doeth alſo gouerne behoueth v knowe ouer ende thing ought referred wee knewe god ſendeth rayne faire weather god thundereth god maketh lightening run flaſſhing ayre attributing ſoueraine power vntoo ſo ſhoulde hee bee knowne bee almightie yet god ſendeth rayne ſhewe ſometymes mynd chaſtize men ſinnes time intent yeeld forth treaſures goodneſſe bountie ynough haue knowne god almightie creature hande diſpoſition wee muſt marke alſo howe maner hee vſeth wit iudge world hee hath borne long ynough ſinnes againe make v feele fauour knowe father ſauiour partie maynteyneth nurriſheth v vve ſee god iuſtice goodneſſe wiſdome muſt linked almightineſſe intent may oneſide taught feare walk obedience ſide reſt ſelues vpon ſeeing haue ſo fayre recordes loue wee may call vpon aſſuring ſelues hee regardeth v pitieth v vnder protection reſort vnto deſtitute counſell hee inſtruct v holy ſpirite nowe wee ſee order nature beeing well conſidered ſerueth onely ſet ſoueraine power god ende men ſhoulde honour acknowledging almightie alſo make v immediatly take holde grace goodneſſe reſt therevppon ſeeke whole refuge alſo behoueth v knowe men ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed bycauſe ſheweth hande thing muſt come accounte thing whiche eliu hath treated according ſhewed yeſterday raine hayle tempeſtes god doth ſometymes iudge worlde ſometimes giue men abundantly wherewith liue hee addeth heart leaped place hee afrayde ſight ſuch thing ſhould ſay knowing god muſt gazing ayre owne lyking meane cōceiue ſome dead thought muſt bee liuely touching heartes power quick generall men vnbeleeuers muche kill feare wherewith ought bee touched whereas faythfull make theyr profite willingly prouoke themſelues ſayde awfulneſſe ende doo homage reuerence maieſtie god let v beare minde god manifeſting himſelfe vnto men onely put ſome fleeting conceyte intoo ſo might ſay god fall reaſoning alſo therewithall giue liuely inſtruction inwardly ſo maye become better minded ſay ought bee men howebeeit wee ſee vnbeleeuers doo vttermoſt power beate backe feare whiche haue conceyued labour playe god get libertie quite cleane oute awe lo poynt faythleſſe ſort ſo fight agaynſte owne naturall vnderſtanding indeuer themſelues become brute beaſtes may ought trouble ſo god agaynſte forſomuch bee giuen euill ſee god cannot away therefore ſhunne labour ridde quite away lyke outlaw theefe woulde faine ciuill magiſtrate worlde ende ſinnes might eſcape vnpuniſhed like cace wyth worldelings foraſmuche cannot disbarre hande god ſo long hee ſitteth maieſtie iudge would fain exempt themſelues iuriſdiction cauſe ſayd labor quench light reaſon giuen thē cannot bring paſſe therefore mule chawe vppon theyr brydles fall repyning agaynſte god howſoeuer worlde go growe hardhearted wexe euerie daye blockiſhe till god haue giuen quite ouer ſo feele remorſe mynde sainct pa 〈…〉 ſpeaketh ſurely extreemeſt miſeries verie vpſhotte theyr decay feele greefe ſay haue remorſe conſcience beare themſelues ſinning go ſtill common trace according alſo salomon ſayeth wicked man come gulfe dungeon iniquitie hee hath feeling returne vnto god humble himſelfe miſlyke faultes contrarywiſe faythfull touched maieſtie god kindle fyre like man hauing alreadie ſome coales ſvrebronde ſhoulde kindle euen ſo deale couet walke vprightly god hath touched themſelues beholding order nature haue perceyued ſoueraine maieſtie guideth gouerneth thing applie reuerende feare owne inſtruction ſo pricke prouoke themſelues heartes reſort vnto god bearing continually remembrance oft haue occaſion looke vpwarde downewarde prepare themſelues knowing god ſo gaze aboute aduenture bethinke themſelues throughly aforehande muſt looke vpon god maker thing vvee ſee whereas wicked heatheniſh ſort labour become blinde therewithall wexe hardhearted againſt god finally become brute beaſtes voyde vnderſtanding diſcretion faithfull take profit knowledge god giueth thē meanes creature cōſequently ſaid light increaſeth groweth ſtrong inforce themſelues vttermoſt power eliu mēt ſaying heart trembled leapt place true wicked ſhall afrayd thunder lightning ſpite teeth maieſtie god muſt touch make ſome ſecrete alarum within yet diſpatche away ſuch thoughtes treade vnder foote contrarie part ſuche deſire knowe god vppon occaſion ſuch beginning ſet applie whole ſtudie aduauntage themſelues feare dreade god ſendeth heartes furthermore eliu vſeth goodly ſimilitudes deſcribing thunder lightning froſt tempeſtes hee ſayeth man may heare god voyce yea euen voyce great noyſe ſayeth hee ſounde proceedeth mouth heere eliu ſpeaketh woorde dayly preached vntoo v v take learning wherein god doth familiarly ſhewe v goodneſſe god roaring voyce noyſe proceedeth mouth hee meeneth thunder made ayre hee declareth ſimilitude lorde hath maner ſpeeche able make creature quake onely place alſo nine twentith pſalme ſayde voyce god thundereth voyce god maketh mountaine libanus rore voyce god clyueth greate tree voyce god maketh hindes caſt calues voyce god hearde mountaynes voyce god maketh whole earth ſhake voyce none thing ſame noiſe made thunder neuertheleſſe ſerueth reproue men vnthankfulneſſe giue eare
