god thundering▪ according alſo common prouerbe men play madde men ſay ſo lowde man could heare god thunder yee ſee scripture vpbraydeth v ſuch blockiſhneſſe bereeueth v excuſe men ſay tuſh neuer learning ſcripture neuer opened vntoo v neuer thunder life god neuer ſpeake haue conceyued ſuch maieſtie ought right ſtoupe honour ſubmit ſelues vnder obedience purpoſe wee bee bad brute beaſtes madneſſe v matched pride cannot conſider hee hath authoritie ouer v ye ſee men ſufficiently conuicted thundereth ought conſider voyce god namely greate lowdſounding noyſe whiche maketh ayre roare againe men ſay bee ignorant darkeneſſe matter make lightning clyue aſunder sky wee ſee ſuche brightneſſe god ſheweth himſelfe ſufficiently ye • euen take couert v man might flatter himſelfe hypocriſie go iuſtifye himſelfe though wee knowne nothing god lightning ynough ſhe v glorie thus yee ſe • eliu ſpeaketh heere greate noyſe ſounde proceedeth oute god mouth hee • argeth matter bycauſe menne retchleſſe one tell fewe woordes matter go aboute lay forth▪ haue greate regarde ſlippeth away hand therefore eliu ſtandeth longer vpon matter purſueth bycauſe wee ought conſider well order thunder lightning alſo rayne deawes ſtormes wee perceyue ſpeaketh expreſſely ſweete gentle ſhowers alſo boyſtuouſneſſe violence ſeene oftentymes behalfe purſuing touched alreadie concerning god iudging worlde ſometyme ſending raine heauen ſomtyme giuing abundance food ſweete rayne come due ſeaſon make earth frutfull otherwiſe raine marre deſtroy benefites whereby looke ſuſtenāce therefore wee perceyue twaine theſe thing god deſerueth well conſidered alſo cauſe ſayd god dooth wonderfull thing comprehende thunder hee ſendeth verie deede hath ſo flaſhed lightning hath flowen throughout thunderclappes haue beene heard immediately commeth tempeſt god letteth raine ſtorme hayle poure downe without tariance wherſoeuer dint tempeſt lighteth inſue incredible thing ye ſhall ſee man conſumed aſhes ſhall keepe ſtill ſhape hardly ſhall yee finde hole ſo bigge peaſe yet notwithſtanding man ſhall bee quite conſumed hard ſwoorde ſhal vtterly molten ſcabber yeeldeth ſhall whole ſtill tree ſhall ſometime rooted vp ſomtime wrung aſunder ſomtime vtterly conſumed ſo ſhalbe nothing left much done houſes bee ſhort man conſider effectes tempeſt bee thing could bee beleeued knowne experience therefore ſtandeth men hande humble themſelues conſidering weakeneſſe owne witte mightineſſe god workes worſe blockiſh wee muſt needes learne heereby ſubmitte ſelues vnto honour yeelde glorie ſoueraintie effect eliu ſheweth v firſt let v beare minde hath beene touched wit ynough v conceyue god maker worlde father power vpon wee muſt alſo knowe father becauſe hee draweth v ſo gentle louing care wee owne child vvhat earthly father doth ſo much thoſe deſcended knowe rightly god behoueth v taſte goodneſſe hee vttereth v maketh v feele whereof wee receyue frutes inioyment euen mortall lyfe nowe wee ſo taſte god goodneſſe leade v witte wee ſhould truſt conſider hee hath put v intoo worlde ende wee ſhould periſhe brute beaſtes bring v euerlaſting heritage hee hath promiſed v therefore wee may well ground right muſt god reaſon benefites wee receyue wee may well conclude ſoules precious bodyes hee vouchſafe ſende v thing requiſite mainteine v world hee leaue cheefe point vvee ſee wee eye open beholde god prouidence order nature ſet afore v ſame would ſerue teache v put whole truſt wee repoſe ſuche truſt wee may alſo call vppon aſſuring ſelues ſith watcheth ouer v prayer ſhall bee vnknowne vntoo hee accept lo wee haue put vre ſurely woulde bee true wiſdome wee could minde theſe thing ſettle thought vppon vve ſhoulde fare better lyfe long vve nothing elſe wander fonde ſpeculations therefore wee reape none rewarde oure owne vanitie vve ſee howe men intangled theſe earthly thing bodie ſpeake heauenly kingdome vnderſtande ſurely bee worthie muche behoueth v take heede conteyned heere namely wee acknowledge goodneſſe god hee nouriſheth v wee bolde call vppon father flee refuge ſeeing hee ſheweth himſelfe bee father haue ſo good gage onely telleth v hys owne mouth alſo hath hande open make v feele wherewith ſyde let v learne feare wee ſee execute iudgements yea euen meanes whiche ſometymes welfare let v learne god myndeth ſubdue v himſelfe teach v ſerue prouoke anger wilfully rather come vntoo reuerence ſith wee knowe hee armed ſuche power reuenge himſelfe diſpyſers maieſtie leaſt hee poure greate terrible puiſſance vppon v alſo cauſe sainct peter bringeth v theſe conſiderations namely god deſtroy worlde wipe away inhabiters earth water notwithſtanding beginning thereof man demaunde whereof ſtuffe worlde made wee ſee holy scripture confuzed matter whiche god ſet downe firſt beginning ſame water wherein nothing depth confuzedneſſe vvell ye ſee ſuch originall beginning world god intended deſtroy mankinde wherewith armed hee himſelfe ſente floud ye ſee water whence wee drawe oure lyfe whiche hathe beene ground woorke whole worlde hath neuertheleſſe beene deſtruction thereof sith wee ſee let v conſider wee haue lowe without hand god whereas lightened sunne whereas draw breath ayre whereas wee nouriſhed fedde bread creature themſelues doo giue mainteyne lyfe god turne death liſteth inſtrumentes hys goodneſſe ſhall bee turned intoo deadly ſwordes deſtroy v let v learne god ſendeth v either hayle noyſom rayne ſore froſtes ſhewing himſelfe terrible thoſe thing ende wee ſhoulde knowe ſinnes entering intoo ourſelues beſeech forgiueneſſe offence paſt learne ſtande awe hereafter obey better wee haue done heretofore moreouer whenſoeuer wee haue felt one ſtripe hande let ſticke minde one day onely let ſerue v thinke vppon euer hath god ſente v drought hath hee ſent v raine vve muſt beare remembraunce looke haue beginne againe bethinke v thus go tyme haue liued worlde haue ſeene ſometymes rayne hathè marred ſeede layd intoo ground ſteade corne men haue darnell nothing againe god hath ſo parched earth heate hath beene ſeared away elſe hath beene ſome winde hath ſhaken downe blaſted ſuſtenance man beaſt haue ſeene haue ſeene alſo ſuche meanes god hath ſent famin nowe muſt tary till god ſtrike againe muſt learning mee tyme lyfe thus ye ſee wiſe wee muſt put doctrine vre moreouer oft heare thunder let v vnderſtand ſounde proceedeth mouth god wittes muſt friske wanze awaye ayre though thunder ingendered without commaundement ſuperiour maiſter let v come vnto god aſſure ſelues thunder muſt needes bee ingendered power mouth ayre ſo troubled rore let v vnderſtand ſame dead thing order god hath ſtabliſhed whereby power manifeſted vnto v ye ſee haue remember perceiue god moueth men heart lightning rayne tempeſts let v aſſure ourſelues doublefolde guiltie wee familiarly taught confuſed noyſe worde ſo offereth v doctrine certaine wherein may edified doubtleſſe wee deſerue much greeuouſly condemned take profite hearing voyce whereby hee dooth ſtrike v feare comfort v true ſoeuer god worde preached ende whereto tendeth make v feele wantes withoute cauſe god woorde tearmed twoo edged ſworde examine men ſearch thought affection ſame cauſe ſayde alſo muſt bee ſacrificed vntoo god meanes goſpell muſt bee kinde dying v elſe god worde ſhall neuer preuaile v vve muſt renounce ſelues whatſoeuer owne nature muſt bee beaten thus ye ſee lord thundereth lightneth worde ſide ſelfe ſame worde hee alſo quickeneth v cōforteth v ſhort giueth v full ioy calleth v himſelf offereth v ſonne guide v thither telling v wee bee aſſured ſaluation ſeeing god ſpeaketh ſo familiarly vntoo v hearken vnto glorifie lyeth greeuous horrible damnation vpon v vppon ſuche neuer teaching theyr onely beholding order nature hearing thunder yet moued inwardely true perceyuerance ſhall ynough condemne v haue ſayd alreadie although men neuer heard eyther lawe ſcripture yet notwithſtanding lyued worlde haue excuſe god ſufficiently declared vnto reproue malice wilfull ſtubbornneſſe vndoubtedly ſee god hath tormented racked greateſt deſpyſers maieſtie euer thunder reade storyes heathen men ye ſhall ſee greateſt ſcorners god euer haue beene ſo frayde afflighted mauger heartes haue ſhewed hearing thunder yea confeſſed god aboue thunder tempeſts whome inforced feare god hath diſtreſſed ſuch wiſe ſet ye would ſay vppon ſcaffolde open execution ſhould done vppon ſome man wrought high treaſon agaynſt prince euen greateſt prince worlde haue taken knowledge thunder tempeſts god heauen gouerneth proofe thunder ought bee ynough bowe hardeſt heartes bee ſeeyng ſuch marke god maieſtie needeth none thing tempeſts lightning ſeene ayre condemne dogges ſwine make mocke religion although neither lawe doctrine wryting yet doth onely thunder holde conuicted ſo ſpite teeth muſt bee faine graunt god heauen voyce whereof mencion made heere ynough condemne men worlde although neuer heard read ſo much one worde doctrine bee wee muſt always come compariſon haue touched god thundering ayre confuſed ſounde bee ſufficient ſpeaking condemne vnbeleuers making lightning flaſh abroade ſufficient light condemne blinde ſhall followe hee ſpeaketh gently vſeth ſo amiable maner teaching yea euen liſpeth v intent wee might vnderſtande better vvhen onely affrighteth v alſo allurerh v gentleneſſe curteſie come vnto wee bee ſtubborne agaynſt ſhall become v vvhat excuſe bee v heere ye ſee pſalme haue alledged ſayde temple god euerie man ſhall giue god glorie prophet ſpoken mightie voyce god maketh mountaynes remoue rockes melt away earth quake tree fall downe mounte libanus wylde goates ſlinke kiddes forreſtes moueth ſhaketh whole world afterward hee addeth god ſhall bee glorifyed temple howe vvhen lightning flaſh throughe wing earth ſay ouer border earth thunderclappes hearde one ſide worlde ought god bee knowne thing ought greate ſmall doo homage yes verely wherefore doth prophete ſpeake ſpecially temple god according compariſon haue touched god affrighteth wakeneth heathen men hee thundereth howbeeit bring ſaluation onely conuince vtterly ende ſhoulde pretende tryfling excuſe knewe god maieſtie knewe ſufficientely vtter condemning v god intent drawe v ſaluation hee ſpeaketh vntoo v hee thundereth make ayre rore neyther maketh hee confuſed noyſe haue ſayde hee ſpeaketh gently familiarly hee vttereth heart vnto v hee ſheweth v way life inlightneth v brightneſſe worde ſhineth vpon v thus ye ſee god deſerueth bee glorified hys temple although hee manifeſted whole worlde creature inuited prayſe yea bee conſtreyned inforced therevntoo yet farre mightie royall power worde preached vntoo v god ſheweth vttereth himſelfe ſuche ſort wee muſt needes bee worſe brutiſh blockiſh wee thinke vpon ſubmit ſelues ſpoken v name authoritie thus ye ſee wee haue beare minde way let v conſider howe malicious worlde ſeeing woorde god ſo well preached knowne notwithſtanding ſo ill receyued moſt men ſo little reuerenced inſomuch ſhoulde ſeeme men purpoſed ſpight god reiecting doctrine notwithſtanding knowe fully aſſured see ye howe rebellious papiſtes day let v go ſo farre let v come home among ſelues men profeſſe themſelues bee minded holde goſpell yet notwithſtanding let bee ſpoken name god let thing laid open let matter bee made ſo plain vnto euen verieſt diuels thē conuicted thing preached taken holy ſcripture yet cōtinue ſtill ſtubbornneſſe without making conſcience ſtriue agaynſt god maliciouſneſſe matched ſhameleſneſſe inſomuch men come ſuch point neede go geneua ſee moſt manifeſt rebellion ſetting light god ſee ſuch diueliſh pride ſay tuſhe god ſhall raigne ouer v let prattle talke liſt yet yeelde whitte verily ſuch rebelliouſneſſe ſeene men make muche account thing ſpoken sermon fable thing notorious example thereof open would god ſuch great confuſion yet ende haue dallyed ſo ſo great mayſter muſt faine knowe whome haue wounded pricked prophete zacharie ſayeth behoueth v marke well ſentence ſo marke wee may bee apt willing bee taught god hande theſe wilde beaſtes ſharpen themſelues agaynſt reiect concerneth doctrine pure woorde yet ſome ſhamefaſtneſſe papiſtes vvhen fight agaynſt holy scripture maintenance idolatryes abhominations ſeeke falſe glozes ſhiftes bee ſhort although couering themſelues bee wette yet notwithſtanding confeſſe intent reſiſt god men ſteppe foorth ſuch vngodlineſſe cannot finde heartes receyue one worde knowne bee god truth frette chafe agaynſt ſo ſo much honeſtie admitte thing knowe good doo cleane contrarie manifeſt therein wee bee much worſe wretched papiſtes vvherefore ſayde leaſtwiſe let thys ſerue v warning bee doublefolde condemned ſpecially aboue thing ſith hee commeth vnto v ſpeaketh v gathereth v togither name ende hearde ſitte ſuch wiſe among v v great ſmall may referre ſelues let v bethinke v glorifie mouth confeſsing ſlightly wee alſo deedes giuing proof effect deſirous heritage▪ ſith vouchſafeth incomprehenſible benefit grace honour vpon v giue himſelfe v life let alſo bee interchaungeable gift ſide let v put ſelues wholy hande let poſſeſſe v let inioy v furthermore whereas ſayde god dooth great mightie thing thundering ſending forth lightning tempeſts wee comprehende let v ſure ſpeaking lawe goſpell hee intendeth lift v vp aboue vnderſtanding verie deede wee ſhall neuer profite doctrine god word ſet forth vnto v haue principle wit god exerciſeth v ſecrets ſurmount capacitie according ſayde god hath prepared ſuche thing thoſe loue neuer eye man ſawe eare man hearde neuer entered intoo heart anie creature wee haue grounde wee ſhall neuer taſte thing preached v euerie day nowe intent wee may taſte well done let v conſider lorde calleth v heauenly kingdome minded draw v worlde intend good ſchollers profite doctrine lorde ieſus chriſt sith ſee plunged ouer heade eares worlde theſe corruptible thing let v labour wade let v day day fight againſt owne affection may draw neere vnto god made al one lord ieſus chriſt according saint paule ſheweth v thirde colloſsians wee minde haue part heauen cleaue vnto ieſus chriſt gone vp aloft bee made one behoueth v mortifie whatſoeuer earth furthermore let v conſider oure wittes rude feeble conceyue god full perfection inſomuch wee ſhall neuer haue ſmall taſte except hee guide v holye spirite according alſo sainct paule maketh ſame concluſion foreſayde text touched hee cyteth ſaying prophete eſay therefore hee hath ſayde ſenſuall man comprehendeth ſecretes god ſayeth bee renued holy ghoſt ende wee may haue knowledge true wee haue beene counſell god according hee declareth againe afterwarde yet dooth hee admit v counſell ſo farre foorth expedient v therefore wee knowe owne infirmitie let v pray inlighten v holy spirite wee may know thing otherwiſe would bee high profounde v nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying make v ſo feele wee may touched condemne ſelues miſlike ſelues meane ſo worke holy ſpirit may renued obey walke feare may profit therin vntill ſuch tyme quite rid fleſhly corruption clothed againe righteouſneſſe heauenly glorie ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father c cxlv sermon ſecond vpon xxxvij chapter 7 ſealeth handes men ende knovve men vvorke 8 beaſtes ſhrinke dennes keepe themſelues vvithin lodging 9 hee maketh vvhirlevvinde come heape colde commeth ſcattering vvinde 10 breath god froſt giuen againe aboundant vvaters narrovve place 11 hee maketh cloudes labour moyſten ſendeth rayne maketh cloude ſhedde light 12 hee maketh circle turne gouernanee ende doo vvhat hee commaundeth ouer vvhole vvorlde 13 vvhither ſcourge earth mercie taketh avvay wee ſaw yeſterday aſtoniſhment whiche men conceyue thunder proofe god maieſtie power according therevnto ſayde heere god thundering doth ſet ſeale vppon men handes keepe cloſe namely ende knowe men making beaſtes alſo faine ſhrinke intoo dennes ſayde god draweth men apart ſome bodie ſhoulde gather folke togither houſeholder houſeholde meynie prince ſubiects capitaine ſouldiours intent muſter thus yee ſee cheefe intent ſtreyne ſame extendeth euen wilde beaſtes ſhewe euen alſo hande god hee proueth commaundement pleaſeth nothing elſe yet • uen thunder ſame compelleth bee ſhet vp priſon verie deede verſe commonly tranſlated god ſetteth seale vpon mennes handes intent ſhoulde knowe owne woorkmanſhip ſhoulde ſay forwardneſſe men haue applie themſelues one thing reaſon god hath printed marke vppon haue otherwiſe inſtruction giuen heauen text ſuffer bee vnderſtoode ſo vvorde worde ende knowe men making folloueth therefore god doth knowe men holdeth maner locked ſhet vp within houſes ende may bee vnderſtoode better men haue libertie go run ſeemeth bee exempted ſubiection fayre weather one go feeldes another ſtreetes ſo men ſeeme bee hilde vnder ſubiection bee fowle weather ſo thunder bluſtering winde abrode men faine keepe within doores therefore like man ſhoulde aſſemble houſholde ſay know behaue themſelues euerie men doth euerie man ſhall make account lo howe god appoynteth men time gathered togither ende make muſters ſhewe ſubiection vntoo ſayde extendeth euen wilde beaſtes beaſtes wander abrode ſeeme ſubiection god maketh ſome tempeſtes ſo bee driuen home dennes muſt men needes perceyue god hath ſecrete bridle holde liſteth vvee ſee thing treated yeſterday declared heere yet expreſſely witte thunder meſſanger god maieſtie onely aſtoniſheth men alſo compelleth hide themſelues houſes one god ſhewed hee holdeth men hys hande mennes going comming abrode bicauſe hee giueth leaue howebeeit hee could holde ſhette vp pleaſure sith wee ſee let v learne yeelde obedience vnto god tymes wee acknowledge ſubiection wee owne vntoo god thundereth ſhall haue profited ſlenderly doctrine neuertheleſſe ſame putting v remembrance conſider hee ruleth ſteppes wee cannot ſtirre one finger withoute guiding therefore let v acknowledge learne bee ſubiect tymes ſuffer ſelues bee gouerned lo wee haue beare away ſtreyne haue aduiſedneſſe diſcretion v behold verie beaſtes able teach v wherefore lion beares vvoolues wilde beaſts keepe themſelues caues dennes bycauſe god ſheweth himſelf bee ſuperiour ouer therefore wee needes runne aſtray ſuffer god holde v ſhet vp vnder hande ſhake ſignet seale ſpoken heere beaſtes ſhall condemne v example beholde yet wee haue beare mynde wee may better profite ſelues whole ſentence hebrewe woorde eliu vſeth heere ſignifyeth properly seale men ſeale letter ende ſhoulde bee looked intoo alſo man maye ſeale cofer cupboorde ſetting seale vpon haue anie bodie looke intoo god vſeth dreadfull kinde ſealing hee ſendeth thunder tempeſts heere printing waxe ring materiall seale hee compelleth men keepe themſelues ſhet vp ſo bee ſort cloſe priſoners theyr owne houſe owne good wittes therefore let conſider mayſter aboue part whole life owne hande thus yee ſee howe ſimilitude ſet downe heere ende wee ſhoulde compare incomprehenſible maieſtie god thing ſee among worldly creature ſayde immediatly god maketh tempeſt come beape clowdes againe ſcattering winde northwinde cauſeth colde come theſe chaunges heere ſet forth god mightie power better ende hee ſhoulde bee glorified thereby truely god kept alwayes one ordinarie rate ſo neuer greate heate great colde anye winde raine ayre alwayes temperate ſuche meaſure kept men might continually feele themſelues diſpoſed one manner thing lyking wee delt oure owne deſyre w 〈…〉 ulde finde oure heartes haue continuall ſprin 〈…〉 ſo might bee oure profite like 〈…〉 th v ſo alſo colde greeueth v wee wou 〈…〉 ine bee exempted haue ayre ſo temperate nothing might bee miſliked nothing go agaynſte oure myndes meane god glorie better perceyued chaunges made hee cauſeth raine fall vppon grounde anone ſcattereth clowdes remoueth rayſeth vp whirlewindes cauſeth colde ſucceede heate ſame doth better ſet maieſtie alſo waketh v ende ſhoulde thinke thereon ſee howe dull men wittes therefore requiſite wee ſhoulde touched quicke true wee witte looke vpon god cleare pure eyeſight giuing v life ſuſtenaunce worlde woulde ynough v forſomuch ſo groſſe therwithall alſo ſo malicious neuer come vnto except driue v perforce behoofe bee touched chaunges made ſee weather fayre ſodainly ayre troubled clowdes thicken heate raine commeth cleareth ayre followeth froſt ſuche drought maye ſeeme earth ſhall bee brunt vppe anon god ſendeth clowdes maketh labour releeue v hee intende giue v reaſonable weather ſay ſee ſuch alteracions muſt wee need woorſe blockiſh thinke vpon god vndoubtedly ſayd afore bringeth himſelf rememberance ſheweth himſelfe manifeſt viſible maner thing ſhould alwayes kepe owne courſe cauſe eliu ſtandeth ſo much vpon text lay foorth expreſſe alteration made ayre fayre wether fowle heate cold clowds cleere wether whirlwind froſts diuers thing ſame cauſe alſo ſayd god gouernment maketh circle turne expound though ſayd world renewed ſuch alteracions happen one ſeaſon yeare long thing woulde looke alwayes one ſort sunne ſhyneth one daye anon ſuddeinly hidden couered behold twoo diuerſe world ſuch varietie prouoketh v conſider better god gouerneth thing howe poſsible thing ſhould alter ſuchwiſe ſhould bee ſuch turning god woorketh aboue vve ſee one whyle earth ſhet v cold ayre alſo poſſeſſed contrarywiſe ſee ſet libertie fayre pleaſant wether lo heere newe worldes ſo without cauſe eliu addeth concluſion god maketh circle ſay world turne making chaunge one faſhion another intent wee bee ſufficiently taught one meane wee ſhould lift vp countenance heauen looke round v leaſtwiſe beholding ſodein alteracions made wee myght bee prouoked knowe god hee myght glorified according alſo haue occaſion ſo haue remember ſtreyne wee ſee mo meanes god giueth v come myght bee taught feare honour ſo much leſſe wee excuſe vnthankfulneſſe ſo much ſhall wee bee blame wee cannot profit ourſelues therfore▪ nother fayre weather fowle heate cold hayle tempeſt ſhal ſet ſelf againſt v iudgement god ſhall beare witneſſe agaynſt v diſcouer ſhewe lewdneſſe v bycauſe wee haue honored hath ſhewed himſelf ſo many wayes ſides allured v behold maieſtie therefore oft weather chaungeth although alteracions bee troubleſome v firſt ſigh 〈…〉 yet let v vnderſtand welfare meanes god wakeneth v ſayd afore hauing faire weather ynough beſotte v ſhould bee chaunge rayne come wee thinke ourſelues verie well god make new world turning hand yea euen without periſhing ſubſtance howbeeit faſhion ſhall ſo defaced ſhall ſeeme new turkined wee conſider wee knowe god vſing ſuch alteration ſee welfare ſaluation furthermore let v marke well faſhyons ſpeeche ſet downe heere greate drought skye ſeemeth yron braſſe ſame maner alſo doeth holy • ſcripture ſpeake vvhen god threateneth puniſh men taking away rayne ſayeth giue earth yron heauen braſſe earth ſhall bee ſhet vp ſo ſhee ſhall open hir breſts giue ſucke heauen alſo ſhall ſo hard ſhall giue rayne rayne come great drought ſame woonderfull men would haue looked ſuch chaunge ſeene come paſſe therfore maruell woontedneſſe dimmeth eyſight maketh v eſteeme god miracle ought neuertheleſſe wether ſo ſoone chaunged altered ſo ſuddeinly darkened thing ſelfe ſheweth ſingular woorking god alſo ſayd god maketh clowdes labour moysten earth▪ namely though clyued aſunder emptied ſelues earth might receiue nouriſhment mark labor whervnto god imployeth cloudes ſeruice dreepeth rayne afterwarde haue ſucked vp moyſture beneathe yeld ouer nouriſhment back againe ende wanze away conſume nothing therfore whē wee heare god guideth creature maner imploy vſe ſhuld ſend v men ſeruantes maydſeruants wage let v therein acknowledge infinite goodneſſe ſayd cloud alſo sunne mone right noble creature yet neuertheleſſe god voutſafeth imploy vſe seing ſo much ſayd sunne moone whome god imployeth ſeruice therein wee ſee loue hee beareth v highly fauor howe precious life vnto truely commeth worthyneſſe yet notwithſtanding behold god ſubmitteth heauens vſe much haue men playd beaſts worſhipping sunne moone ſame cauſe god telleth way vpbraiding appointed ſeruice therefore ſeing god maketh cloudes earth alſo labour trauell ſorte let v remember aboue beneth ſheweth v fatherly loue making v feele goodneſſe intent ſhould cō ſider deare welbeloued notwithſtanding wretchedneſſe v wee worthy reckned amōg reſidue creature men compared earth ayre brute beaſts certaine vnworthy nouriſhed bicauſe corrupted marred therfore haue ſomuch cauſe magnifie god goodneſſe towardes v furthermore whereas ſayde chaceth awaye cloudes bryghtneſſe yet one chaunge whiche woonderfull oughte make v perceyue hande god beholde wether cloſe ſeemeth v wee haue quyte cleane loſt ſight sunne wee acquainted ſuche alteration wee woulde thinke water threatned burie v hande good ſooth cloudes haue ſo ouercaſt whole ayre earth ſo wet men ſee graue god maketh cloudes vaniſhe away minute hour whome may imputed truely wee ſay order nature ſay cuſtome howſoeuer yet muſt needes perceiue hande god blockiſh therefore let v beare mynde ſuperfluous talke eliu vſeth diuerſitie matter ſhewe maieſtie god ſetteth foorth worlde ſaide varietie time intent draw v vnto ſayth expreſſely ſendeth clo • de whirlwindes doe thing hath ordeyned whole worlde hee ſhould ſay behoueth v alwayes conſider god mightie power dominion ouer thing wee ſee may learne perceiue owne ſinnes hee puniſheth v adde againe anon alſo end may ſo taſte goodneſſe may throughly filled pleaſeth handle v gently end may knowe theſe thing let v conſider creature gouerne ſelues god diſpoſeth thinketh good whatſoeuer commaundeth vpon e • th hereof haue good leſſon gather cauſe ſo afrayde thunder thing feare god iuſt puniſhment vnbeleefe men feare god whither ſendeth euē ſenſleſſe creature put greater ſhame loke vpon deſpizer god trampleth religion vnder foote caried away diueliſh rage ſhaketh al difference good euill yet notwithſtanding inforced afraid thunder inſomuch wittes traunce marke payment deſerue loth yeelde obedience vnto god ſtand awe ſenſleſſe creature let v learne graunt oure god mightie power belongeth vnto end may exempted fearefulneſſe ignorant vnbeleeuers haue cankerdhearted ſort deſpizers religion knowe god guideth gouerneth tempeſtes ſhal perceiue hande ſhall free danger pleaſeth thūder nothing although ſee flie abroad ſhoote heauen earth moment yet ſtill hand god therfore like ſworde cannot wound men either flat vpon earth ſcabberd euen ſo thunder lightning nothing ſimply themſelues god darteth hee liſteth wee knowe wee ſhall bee afrayde thunder true abaſhe v therewithall ſerue v ſpurre pricke v forewarde wee may bee confirmed feare god profite therein neuertheleſſe ſo euer come wee bee diſmayed thunder bycauſe wee ſure god diſpozeth ourſelues alſo cuſtodie ſo thunder doe thing againſte v pleaſeth likewiſe wee muſt bee afrayde hayle ſendeth vvee muſt bee ouerfearefull tempeſt ſo wee ſhould bee diſmayed wee muſt tremble maieſtie oure god wee haue trembled muſt mortifie fleſhly affection take comfort giueth v contrarie part ſhewing ſelfe father towardes v beholde ſay howe wee ought put ſentence vre theſe creature alſo muſt ſerue v example ſith wee ſee rayne windes ſtormes thing doe execute ſo euer god commaundeth ought wee doe hath rayne eares heare god appoynteth nother sunne earth cloud ayre haue reaſon vnderſtanding yet wee ſee theſe creature ſerue obey god falleth one droppe rayne grounde without sunne doth nother ryze ſet otherwiſe god hath limited pace aſſigned courſe ſo muche hee miſſeth one twincling eye much ſayde creature v haue ſpeech whiche haue eares heare haue vnderſtanding reaſon haue ſufficient euidence condemn v apply al thoſe thing obeying god ſeing whole order nature nought elſe thā proof obedience creature aboue beneath yeeld vnto god vvee hath bene ſayde alreadie men making alſo ſayd pſalme man made ſelfe god made seing hold thing ought ſtrength hath giuen v furie ruſh againſt reſiſt ſtoppe hauing free courſe yet notwithſtanding marke indeuers ſhoote conſider wherein men moſt frowarde wee ſhall finde neuer leaue reſiſting god fighting againſt ſo ſeeking aboliſhe truth wherein wee ſee ſo muche greater ſpitefulneſſe therefore let v bee ſure rayne wyndes ſtormes tempeſtes ſuch like thing ſhall giue gloſſe diueliſhe rebelliouſneſſe ceaſſe prouoke god wrath plucke men obeying ſubmitting ſelues bee quietly gouerned lo wee haue marke ſeconde place ſentence ſayde throughe vniuerſall worlde creature doe ſo euer god hath ordeyned nowe effecte ſee heere prouidence god order nature howbeit muſt come backe treated yeſterday eliu bringeth v hee ſayth whither ſcourge earth mercie ſaying ſo ſheweth touched yeſterday ynough knowe thing vnder god hand nothing done diſpoſing muſt alſo marke ende purpoſe cauſes hee worketh ſo nowe wittes feeble ſo muche although god chawe meate v yet wee diſgeſt mindes doctrine ſet foorth vnto v percelmeale god maketh familiar yet bee ſo dulheaded wee vnderſtande requiſite howe ſhould wee doe wee generall knowledge god gouerning world wee better particular inſtruction whereby knowe goodneſſe iuſtice wiſdome ende wee might bee drawne feare ſettle ſelues vpon truſte mercie cauſe ſayde heere agayne whither bee ſcourge earth mercie vvhereas ſayde whither bee ſcourge thereby eliu ſheweth god chaſtizeth world raine heate cold tempeſtes ſtormes theſe euerie one god ſcourges wherewith ſmiteth v ſinnes yet notwithſtanding v onely hee hathe created world conſidering hee pitieth earth ſaying alſo men woorthie hee ſhould vſe mercie towardes howbeit myndeth maynteyne earth owne workemanſhippe afterwarde ſerueth may hee ſometimes haue eye himſelfe thing hee hath created ſo hee reſtreyneth rigour executeth full moderateth notwithſtanding haue prouoked therefore behoueth v conſider gracious goodneſſe poynte aboue vnleſſe hee forgiue v ſinnes leaſtwiſe beare time ſurely earth ſhoulde periſhe vnder v world ſhould conſumed yea euen vtter deſtruction god giueth right great record mercie pleaſeth ſpare v manner concluſion ought ſerue v double purpoſe one confirme hath bene ſet forth alreadie told yeſterday make v feare god ſerue put whole truſt ſay diſcourſe concerning god gouernement reſpecte worlde better warranted wee ſee diuers faſhions varietie chaunges example peraduenture god chaſtize v ſendeth ſome dearth nowe dearth commeth ſome one cauſes afore mencioned namely eyther froſt drought noyſome rayne tempeſtes ſo ayre puniſheth v ayre ſenſleſſe thing rayne bethinketh ſelfe correcte faultes men may alledge v natural reaſons ſay rain windes ſtormes ingendered ſuch meanes ſuch philoſophers well bring reaſons ſay hath ſome beginning diſpozed ſome inferiour cauſes meane ſeaſon doe chaſtizementes god ſendeth vpon v come shall man father vpon inferiour cauſes beholde countrie miſgouerned meete god hande ſhould paſſe vpon according wherevnto commeth rough ſcourge vpon ſhal ſay nature working ought wee acknowledge iudge heauen chaſtizeth coūtries ſheweth v cannot ſcape hande haue done amiſſe let v bee ſure god vttereth fauoure goodneſſe ſendeth v ſeaſonable pleaſant weather contrariwiſe puniſheth ſinnes tranſgreſſions ſendeth v foule vnſeaſonable wether nowe knowe namely rayne rayzed owne naturall mouing ſtormes tempeſts ingendered without god ſending appointing ſo euer thinketh good doctrine ſhall bee ſo muche better ratified lo howe ſpeciall concluſion leadeth v ſo muche better vntoo god alſo ſeconde poynt ſeeing rayne whyrlewyndes hayle god ſcourges wee muſt learne humble ſelues hee correcteth v let ſtrike vpon v vayne let v bee plyable vnder ende humble oure ſelues ſuche wiſe hee may reygne quietly ouer v truely foule ſhame v wee muſt driuen ſeruice force main ſtrokes cudgel ſeeing hee allureth v ſo gently nature childe looke ſo inforced loth come father compulſion yet notwithſtanding god faine worke faſhion v conſidering oure ſtubborneſſe vntowardneſſe bee handled conſtreyned vſe roughneſſe leaſtwiſe yet let v bow vnder wee feele rough ſtrokes ſtriking v hayle rayne thunder wynde froſt tempeſtes drought therefore wee feele ſo ſmart blowes hand god maketh v quake ſame feare ſerueth diſmaye v bring v vnder lure wee might craue forgiueneſſe oure ſinnes let v learne wee bee worthie ſo beaten let v vnderſtande wee ſhall ceaſſe prouoke vengeance except giue v hart holie ſpirite ye ſee howe god ſcourges ought ſtirre v vp come vnto intente feare honour heerewithall let v marke whereas ſayde earth god hath reſpect ſelf deſtroyeth v vtterly doe ſee god ſuffereth v liue although many aduerſities yet doe wee ſee fauour forbearing needes ſhould wee bee vtterly wyped away firſt brunt hee ſhould deale v deſeruing therefore let v marke howe ſayde god doth earthes ſake yea bee worthie haue done ſakes therefore ſhetteth eye voutſafeth think vpon ſo ſhamefull creature ye ſee heere diſdeyne ſet forth vnto v witte god none conſideration v hee might rende vp heauen earth deſtroy v ſerueth bereaue v pryde make v ſo much aſhamed ende might leaue flattering ourſelues ſee mē wold fain hide filthineſſe plight ſoeuer ceſſe like well thē ſelues▪ conceyue wote vayne imagination bee great value ſayde heere god eſteemeth valueth earth deſerue eſteemed neuertheleſſe intent ſhould diſmayed hee addeth purpoſely therethrough god ſetteth foorth mercie hath hee abaſhed v ſaying hee diſdeineth haue reſpect v turneth againe ſaith yet vſe pitie make feele mercie▪ ſpare yea howbeit bycauſe bee worthie wee muſt alwayes conclude ſo euer god v hath reſpect vnto thing v come humilitie acknowledge wee haue deſerued deſtroyed god hande doth hee ſhewe v hee goodneſſe ſurmounteth oure naughtineſſe cauſe hee addeth ende god doth euen meere goodneſſe mercie nowe hereof haue gather rayne come due ſeaſon faire weather alſo wold wiſh wee haue deſerued god ſhould deale ſo gently v nother muſt myndes rome vpon wage yeeldeth v though hee bounde v ſide ſuch dutie ought vſe ſo tenderly child vvhat meere mercie deſerued wel ſtarue hunger reaſon ſhould ſende v nouriſhment bycauſe good pitifull vvee deſerue rooted world hee reacheth hand feede v father doth child therin therefore wee ſee vndeſerued goodneſſe lo howe ought magnifie god benefit dealeth vnto v taking wage hyre ſayde ought pay v wee haue deſerued hande free giftes meere goodneſſe liberalitie towardes v heerevpon haue conclude muche hee beareth v euen haue offended ought ouerwhelmed hād ceaſſeth play father ſtill yea euen vpon oure body whiche carions ſmoke thing nought inaſmuch ſay lord worketh ſo bountifully towards body ought bee confirmed right truſt hee receiue v mercie readie forgiue v faultes ſo euer aske forgiueneſſe hand ſee lord doth dayly call v ſaluation eate one bit breade vſe temporall benefit hee beſtoweth vpon v hee openeth heauen vnto v ſay come bee father haue mercie vpon ſinnes ye ſhall alwayes finde readie receyue ſo ye deſire bee maynteined meere mercie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying ſo touch v quicke miſliking ourſelues may deſire earneſtly clenzed grace therwithall much order nature giueth v ſo faire lookingglaſſes glorie goodneſſe iuſtice wee beholding may bee rauiſhed walke feare ſo may ſerue honour yelde ourſelues wholy obeyſance end may lead v peaſably whither pleaſeth may c cxlvj sermon third vpon xxxvij chapter 14 heare theſe thing ô iob ſtay thy ſelfe conſider vvonders god 15 knovveſt thou hovv god hath ſet lavve hovve hee maketh light ſhine clovvde 16 vnderſtandeſt thou ſcatterings clovvdes myracles perfecte knovvledge 17 hovve thy clothes vvarme vvhen maketh sovvthvvinde blovve 18 vvart thou vvith ſtretch heauen vvhich faſt molten glaſſe 19 tell v vvhat vvee ſhall ſaye vvee order oure matter bicauſe darkeneſſe 20 thou ſpeake vvho vvill report ifany man tell ſhall hee ſvvallovved vp 21 vvhen sunne hid men ſee light againe vvinde blovveth bringeth cleereneſſe 22 fayre vveather commeth north therefore god ought bee exalted vvith prayſe 23 hee mightie goodneſſe hee ſtrong povver iudgement iuſtice hee afflicteth 24 therefore doe men feare hee vvill regarde vvize ovvne conceyte wee knewe ſayde heere work god wit wonderfull none v hee would take much paine conſider ſpecially ſeing wit ſo ſlender frail think ſelues ſo skilfull euen one little caſt eye wee haue learned bee knowne meane whyle eſteeme god workes according worthyneſſe common thing v bycauſe wee accuſtomed ſo ouerpaſſe lightly therefore behoueth v mark wel conteyned verſe one ſyde eliu proteſteth god workes myracles ſide ſaith behoueth v ſtay vpon namely bicauſe wit feble haue true knowledge hand therefore neede beſtowe ſtudie therevpon furthermore commaunded expreſly bea • ken except god ſpeake vnto v v may well apply al wittes conſidering workes ſhall neuer come cheef point yee ſee haue three point beare mynde one concerneth excellencie maieſtie bee ſeene god workes ſo bee deſpized ſecond much men rude groſſe witted looking vpon thing god ſetteth afore muſte bee caſting eye aſide glaunce awaye muſt ſtay vpō ſettle mind throughly diligent vttermoſt third muſt truſt owne reaſon thinke ſelues haue skill ynough iudge conſider belongeth god ſhew v worde haue conceyue point whereat muſt beginne till haue bene god ſchole wee ſhall haue dim eyeſight ſo workes ſhall paſſe away v wee perceiue requiſit v ſhort wee ſhall haue diſcretion vntill god haue made v wiſe yet theſe thing neede ſo greatly layde foorth length well weyed euerie v therefore ofte come conſidering god workes let v lifte vp wit alofte reuerence ſay honour god infinite wiſedome power rightuouſneſſe appeere let ſerue one point bee ſhorte ſo euer thinketh vpon god work without reuerencing ſay without yeelding honour without acknowledging full wiſdome power goodneſſe vnkynd traterous vnto god therefore oft man ſpeakes v god work let v yeeld reuerence take miracle ſurmount wit wherein god vttereth maieſtie ſuche ſorte wee haue good cauſe honour beſides haue touched already muſt ſide conſider ourſelues end take ourſelues bee ſo ſharpwitted knowe thing moment let v contented breathe vpon thing conceiue firſt ſight let v bee wearie ſtudie wee haue lyued good worlde ſtill nouices haue perfecte vnderſtanding bee wiſhed yet let v heart go forward ſtil without ſtudie wee ſhall haue profited much oure whole life haue learned vnderſtande wonder conteyned workes god howbeeit true behoueth v go ſtill foreward whereas place mention made ſtaying ment wee ſhould bee ydly occupied gazing aboute muſing vpon god muſte hinder oure ſeruing imploying ſelues thing hath appoynted cleane contrariwyſe wit man conſidereth god workes ought bee ſtirred vp duetie ought hee prouoked thruſt foreward therevnto truely ſtay thinking vpon god workes doe goe backe leape better end wee ſhould bee wanderer wee ſee men runne trotting vp downe place place could find hart remoue world ſo letted enterpriſes may well breake armes legges yet neuer ſoreward hold right way vvhat bee done let v bee guided ſober aduiſedneſſe ſo let v ſtay ſuch wiſe vpon god workes wee may bee reſtreyned wandring ſort become ſtragglers howbeeit therewithall let v alſo apply ſelues god commaundeth let bee marke ſhoote furthermore let v aſſure ourſelues owne nature haue nother wit reaſon giue eare vnto god belongeth ſhewe v wee ought conſider workes may fare better true heathen men haue diſputed curiouſly ſecretes nature manner nothing hath beene hidden yea muſing vpon worlde comming vnto god elſe ſuche wiſdome confuzed dungeon vnthankefulneſſe men ſhould ſo curiouſly ſearch god workes thinke vpon maker whit regarde therefore curſed wiſdome buzieth ſelfe curiouſe ſearching inferiour lower cauſes meane whyle deſpyzeth maker yet notwithſtanding certayne god gaue vnderſtanding thoſe treated ſo curiouſly order nature howbeeit much heard god ſpeake worde guide aright miſſed way cheefe point ſhould haue ſubmitted themſelues vnto god conſidered glorie whiche appeereth v workes let v marke well whenſoeuer reade theſe great philoſophers heare ſpeake perceyue howe knew thing ſeeme incomprehenſible v lookingglaſſes blindneſſe men vntill god haue taught ſchole ſharperwitted thoſe men vve come farre ſhort yet ſee taſte god therefore deſirous comprehende god workes let v truſt skilfulneſſe nother let v preſume vpon owne naturall power let v herken god ſpeketh v taught wordes let v go guiding ſhal know work ſuch ſorte wee ſhall apply oure vſe inſtruction thus much concerning firſt verſe nowe eliu goeth forward immediatly matter asketh whither iob tell commaundement god hath giuen creature ordinance hath ſet cloud ſhedeth light thē whether know order diſpoſition cloudes woonders perfect knowledge vvhen hee ſayth knoweſt thou god ſet lawe creature two thing noted one god onely hath created workes alſo hee gouerneth ſtill applyeth ſuch vſe thinketh good according haue declared theſe former dayes howbeit much ſaying ſet downe newe againe let v wey throughly importeth good leſſon thing man ſhuld tell v god create world thing fall may verie ſlender cold tale yet ſo heathen men almoſt euerie one thē meane thoſe ſome good ſparke religion let paſſe thoſe braynſicke beaſts opinion world without beginning wizeſt euer meene ariſtotle ſuppozed neuer match yet notwithſtanding hee reſteth vpon poynte diuell ſo carie away hee knewe maker worlde although knewe god yet knewe creation worlde yee would ſay face god haue men looke vpon thoſe whiche ſeede religion although knewe god created worlde yet vnderſtood prouidence wherin thing conteyned ſo much thing created power continue ſtil goodneſſe wiſdome iuſtice thing vnknowne heathen men therefore let v remember well doctrine conteyned heere whiche conformable ſaying lord ieſus chriſte father worketh yet ſtill ſame wiſdome whereof salomon ſpeaketh eyght prouerbes wee knowe ſurely god maker heauen earth confeſſe let v therewith call remembrance hee guideth thing hee hath forgotten creature ordereth owne pleaſure therby wee may conclude cloud gather togither aire auenture nother ingendered pleaſure earth god guideth thinges ſetteth order bothe fayre weather foule ſo bothe come ſouerain dominion inſomuchas neuer falleth one drop rayne nother euer fayre wether nother euer little puffe wynd lorde hath commaunded creature although bee ſenſleſſe haue ſecrete mouing gouerneth aboue al thus much concerning firſt point ſecond place ſhewed v vnderſtand this▪ ſharpwitted ynough know therefore muſt ſtoupe vnder word god fayth muſt vnderſtanding ye ſee one ſide god prouidence warranted vnto v intent ſhould doubt thing gouerned wil therwithall behoueth v take knowledge rudeneſſe v ende although wee cannot iudge thing many thing paſſe reach yet ſhuld therfore think nothing run backe ſayd concerning herkening wit ſmall feeble let v reſort god ſhewe v thing hidden vnknowne wee muſt iudge oure owne fancie horrible confuzion th • n mannes reaſon ſubmit ſelfe god worde nowe iudge viſible thing thing concerne worlde furtherforth god inlighteneth v holie ſpirite guydeth v worde doe concerning god euerlaſting kingdome whiche farre hygher without compariſon thing ſpoken heere vve able iudge worldly viſible corruptible flyghtfull thing ſhall iudgement reache ſpirituall kingdome god muſt needes come ſhort therefore let v learne humble ſelues modeſt meanes come knowing thing belong ſaluation wee mynde profit well therein let v firſt acknowledge wee bee able knowe aught otherwiſe god teacheth v therefore let v referre ſelues vnto contented guyded worde wee ſee thing wee couet knowe let v aſſure ſelues lord intendeth humble v let v cace play braynleſſe ſorte iudge imaginacion contented remember leſſon ſhewed v god worde thus yee ſee howe wee ought put ſentence vre nowe way eliu ſpeaketh thing ſeene yet reaſon incomprehenſible true men may ſay ſomewhat end muſt needes conclude god wonderfull workes high v therefore ſayth come canſt thou diſcuſſe mee thy clothes warme whē god giueth reſt earth ſouth wind ſay ſommer wether whot sunne beareth power wynde drawe northward ſouth wynde reigne yet notwithſtanding wind none ſuch man may perceiue l • ke sommer time wether calme true coole gale come peraduenture frō ſouth yet ſuch winde may bee perceyued weather ſhall bee ſo ſtill man ſhall perceyue wynd ſtirring doe men ſwelt heate bycauſe weather whotteſt cauſe ſayd god maketh earth quiet southwinde canſt thou ſuche time ſo muche iudge ſweat iſſueth thy bodie thou ſeeſt thy clothes wet beſides thy clothes ſhall burne thee sunne haue ſhone ſo long vpon heat ſo ſhal able fence heat thee canſt thou tell reaſon hereof againe wart thou god ſaith ſpread heauen vve ſee work mirrour molten glaſſe lo maruellous molten work ſpreading heauen art thou able comprehend ineſtimable power god ſheweth ſelf al theſe thing haue effect gather vpon theſe ſayings although ſome naturall cauſes heate cold yet doth followe wee vnderſtande specially ſouthwind beareth ſway sommer time men burne heate without feeling great blaſt gale wynde wee may well perceyue ſome inferior reaſon thereof neuertheleſſe haue known yet muſt come power hidden god yea ſo hidden wittes forced faile dazled hereby ſee howe proude men flinging rouers diſpute againſt god ſet ſchoole reply vpon murmure doings ſhewe ſome token miſliking diueliſh pride ſo wee able perceyue ſo much cauſe ſweating heate sunne vve perchaunce ſay sunne whot yea howe ſweate ingendred bycauſe bodie loozened ſame loozening doth ſo open bodie moyſture cannot tarie within cold wether poares ſhet vp moyſture ſhrinketh inwarde nouriſhe man life whereas contrarie doone heate agayne heate ingendereth feebleneſſe feebleneſſe maketh humor melt ſo ye ſee cauſes ſweting men may well diſpute ſorte done muſt needes acknowledged maruellous ſecretes bodie man god hath planted ſuch workmanſhip wee bee wittes ende haue well conſidered thinke ſo much ſhame v vnthankfulneſſe beaſtly againe perchaunce diſcourſe howe heauen made ſuch roundneſſe much bigger earthe moreouer matter ſubſtance made wit firie matter howe maynteyned ſuche perfecte ſtate order finally maner wheeleth whe ſayde muſt needes acknowledge god worketh greate reaſon behalfe howe great euen infinite whereat mennes wit muſt needes ſtoupe ſay surely wonderful workmayſter god worketh ſuche ſort muſt needes honor ſecrets worſhip work acknowledge power atteyne ſuch hyghneſſe thus ye ſee wherevnto holy ghoſtintendeth bring v texte therfore ofte ſee reaſon thing doone nature ſo perceiue meanes god worketh therewithall vnderſtande iuſtice power wiſdome let v always learne conclude yet notwithſtanding cannot comprehend hundreth part much haue ſome litle taſt ſo wee get licke tip tung yet haue taſt nother excepte giuen v aboue howbeit let v way marke well knowledge wee haue ſerueth make v feele rawneſſe vnderſtanding wee might humble ſelues god vpon knowing vnabilitie ſeke taught profite furthermore let v neuer werie ſetting oure mindes conſidering god workes ſeing may get ineſtimable treaſure learning neuer ſo ſmall portiō yea though entering ſome taſte ſayd afore ſhall haue ſpent whole life ſhall haue done much haue come half way vntill ſuch time lord gather v wholy fully himſelfe thus ye ſee touching heate ſpoken touching workmāſhip ſee sky molten lokingglaſſe yet notwithſtanding ſcope infinite therfore need muſt workemaiſter wonderfull lo ought put leſſon vre ſayd immediatly tell v ſhall ſay order matter bycauſe darkeneſse heere eliu mocketh iob meane doctrine toucheth v whiche preſume take hold talke god reply againſt muſt tel v ſhuld ſpeak vnto god may alledge end may ſhew ſome fault found work one holy ghoſt ſhould ſay go ther none ſo ſelfwiſe take vpon picke ſome quarel god work ſoothly conſider ouerboldneſſe al men wee ſhall ſee god content v oure power euerie v would put peece haue ſnatch ſaying vvhy ſuch thing doone good bee ſhort would terrible hotchpotch god ſhuld herken wiſhes follow wherof commeth diueliſh pride needes bee wiſe finding fault god doings behold heere howe holie ghoſte ſcorneth ſuche preſumptuouſneſſe ſayth seing euery taketh vpon bee ſo great craftes maiſters • ell v ſhal ſpeak vnto god ye come ſay goe haue ſuch thing done ye muſt ſhewe ſome reaſon reaſon ye bring vnto god told v ſet purpoſe bycauſe men intangle ſelues owne fantaſticall imaginacions diſcontēted god workes beſeech giueth v ſuch leaue miſſebehaue ourſelues againſt god reply regard maieſtie regard certen would quake feare nought holie ghoſte bringeth v ſpeaking god ſhould ſay go tell v ſhall ſay fall muttering behind backe ſome cowardly wretch would ſeeth mā corage authoritie whoſe doings miſliketh one wil find fault yet hee dare open lippes face go away moyling himſelf worke ſpite forge ſlaunders behinde backe among mate ſpueth conceiued afore ſaying behold pray ſuch man think ſelfe verie wiſe great skill like maruell howe men ſuffer talke faſhion ſame manner deale wee god bee ſo hardie ſpeake openly againſt verie deede nature teacheth v ought make v ſhudder ſo lift vp ſelues againſt hathe made faſhioned v meane whyle wee ceaſſe bee ſo ſpitefull wicked grudge repine againſt huckermucker picke quarels vvherefore oft tempted find fault god work let v learne come bethink v conteyned heere namely ſhall ſpeake vnto poynt may begin ſhal haue cauſe repreſſe ourſelues folie v muſt needes ſubdewed fall vtterly grounde thus yee ſee muſt take ſentence ſayd tel v may ſay vnto god wheras ſaid cannot order matter bycauſe darkneſſe therein ignorantneſſe men better expreſſed vnto v heere wrapped darkneſſe ſo ſee whit order matter behold god dwelleth light ſo ſeeth sunne ſhyneth mortall man doeth man walke hygh nonedayes ſeeth way giues himſelfe thing light sunne guide direction intend view ground poſſeſsions looketh round god therfore hath alſo dwelleth ſo gret infinit light nothing hiddē al thing open vnto time paſt time come reacheth euen deepes dungeon haue ſeene heretofore teach leſſon ſeing dwell darkneſſe man wereſhet vp ſawe whit light yet ſhould ſay another man thou woteſt thou doeſt shall blinde wretch tell welſighted man knowes way ſeeth hee doth compare ſelues god certein worſe blind ſeeth maner men hath far maner fight therefore muſt need worſe mad preſume gainſay find occaſion reaſon againſt cauſe darkneſſe ſpoken heere let v conſider ſtate alſo ſtate god ſhall ſhet mouthes preſume pleade againſt ſuch libertie doe ſhalbe lowlineſſe v fal low whatſoeuer god doth confeſſe nothing rightfulneſſe wiſdome goodneſſe equitie iuſtice ſo remaineth thing v glorify reſpects knew ſome one litle peece doings yet ſhould need condemne owne infirmitie cannot glorifie god ought reaſon ignoraunce heere way let v marke well men rebuked raſhneſſe make haſte ſpeake knowe thing vvee ſee howe tickle tongue ſpecially talke god wonder vvee deſcant vpon howe aduenture yet notwithſtanding wee bee darkeneſſe therefore let v learne rule talke according ſmalneſſe howbeit therewithall ſide let v conſider infinite goodneſſe god inlightneth v middeſt darkeneſſe word although vnderſtande perfectly poynts howe made world perceyue meanes whereby worketh ſtill yet ceaſſeth make v priuie minde ſo farre forth needefull v cauſe ſayde god wiſdome kept companie hee made worlde rayzed vp mountaynes ſunke valleyes ſtabliſhed order wee ſee ſayde alſo ſame wiſdome cryeth ſtreetes ſaying come giue ſelfe redie talke familiarly men yea delight whole pleaſure dwell inhabiters earth seeing god wiſdome ſelfe incomprehenſible v proteſteth hir delight pleaſure dwel v bee familiar v pray haue wee cauſe good chere watchfull take profit thing god ſheweth v howbeit ſuch ſoberneſſe modeſtie wee may couet knowe ought teacheth v glorifie yeelding deſerued prayſe thus yee ſee haue marke verſe nowe conſequently ſayde ſpeake ſhall reporte vnto ſhall bee bee ſwallowed vp dareth vtter one worde eliu expreſſeth yet better thing haue touched afore witte vnaduiſed wordes whiche wee ſhoote foorth concerning god wanderingimaginations wee conceyue braynes grudgings made huckermucker therevnto tendeth ſimilitude whiche alledged cowarde durſt ſtirre one finger yet notwithſtanding falles moyling againſt thoſe whome god hath giuen diſcretion ſeketh wiſe backbyting men euen ſo deale godward none v hath much boldneſſe skill reply againſt god doings yet al brabble hee voutſafeth heare oure word eliu ſheweth men ſhal gaine nothing ſettling thē ſelues maner againſt god ſhall reporte ſome begger ſhould ſpeake great king ſay o▪ meete king ſhoulde better aduized might anſwered freende muſte get ſome meſſenger goe giue aduertizemente whiche ſpeake ſeeing kyng hath aduice wiſedome ynoughe excepte counſell beſt go giue aduice elſe finde ſome meſſanger ſend counſell poore begger ſhould ſpeak ſo euery man would mocke cauſe mocke follie take vpon v ſpeak ſo vnaduiſedly god workes therefore let v marke well manner ſpeaking whiche ſet downe namely ſhall report debate matter heere lowe yet meane whyle wee bee frogges frogges make great crooking well ynoughe mariſhes puddle yet men paſſe ſtay crooking euen ſo talke men hold reaſon babble yet beare themſelues hande god hold peace doe would haue cleane contrarie therefore let v learne ſo euer lifte vp neb againſt god ſhall winne nothing wordes ſhall ſlip ayre vaniſh away ſmoke neuertheleſſe let v marke way word ſhal fall ground muſt regiſtred great horrible confuzion pryde ſuch dare murmure againſte god ſuche blaſphemouſneſſe muſte needes come reckening ſcape vnpuniſhed therefore let v imagine gayne thing againſt god whenſoeuer tempted ſtand contention let v call ſaying remembrance namely ſhall report true god hereth nothing eſcapeth yet voutſafeth ſtoupe bibblebabble thoughe wee match tuſh frogges ſayd afore ſhort ſerueth ſhewe v wee ſhall neuer get vpper hande pleading againſt god moreouer reaſō ſhuld abace ſelf ſo much anſwere v toucheth cannot come neere babbling although wee fyle tung ſo cut ſlyce ſmoothely aire yet ſhall god abyde ſtill ſafe ſound hee needeth ſtreyne himſelfe reply againſte v find excuſe needeleſſe let v learn ſpeak ſuch reuerence word ſhall vtter may bee made prayſings ſo god may accept may purging oure tunges ſay vttering nothing commeth word haue learned ſchole concluſion let v marke eliu addeth man ſpeake ſayth ſhall ſwallowed vp ſheweth v heere confuſion prepared ſuch dare ſo ſet themſelues againſt god would fayne finde fault workes vvhat ſhall gayne end ſhall ſwallowed vp vve ſee creature muſt needes tremble god maieſtie ſhalbe done manifeſt rebellion god one frown make mountaines rock melt emptie ſea deſtroy whole world liſt ſurely rebellion nother earth water reſt ſuche creature behold man handfull duſt needes wage battle againſt maker pray hold world ſhould periſh ſone came vnder god hand behold worme wretched carion wil put god ſilence ſo wil alſo rob god honoure haue bee counted wyſe ryghtuouſe hee woorthie ala muſt needes worſſe blynd come ruſhing ſuch boldneſſe againſt therfore let v marke well according haue touched ſet vp briſtles ſorte againſt god wee ſeeke owne deſtruction bee quyte ſwallowed vp vvill mainteyned vnder hand keeping god let v learne humble ourſelues pray ſhewe ſelfe v according ſhall haue pleaſed ſhewe himſelfe ſo alſo graunt v grace walke continuall modeſtie haue eye alwayes vpon marke namely hee deſerueth bee honoured hand acknowledging ſelues owe ſuche reuerence may learne ſubmitte v wholly vnto thus ye ſee howe may approch vnto god without feare fyre terrible wrathe nay rather let v ſure bee refreſhing vnto v ſo wee ſhall mainteyned grace condicionally wee come humilitie withoute preacing ouer farre inquire ſecretes therefore wee muſt contente ſelues ſheweth v worde aſſuring ſelues reach v hand v go hee guydeth v nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement fault praying make v feele continually much pleaſeth graunt v ſo greate aboundance worldly benefites haue applyed ordeyned creature vſe wee receyuing ſuche bountifulneſſe hande may learne knowe father aſſuring ſelues ſeeing hath care body world hee fayle v thing concerne ſpirituall life ſoules although world bee tangled many affection comber wittes ſo bee libertie conſider god workes accordingly yet wee may therefore ceaſſe take courage muze vpon meane ſeaſon guide v ſuche wiſe holie ſpirite wee may learne like well doings glorifie iuſtice truth goodneſſe vertues ſheweth v dayly workes may pleaſe c cxlvij sermon firſt vpon xxxviij chapter lorde anſvvering iob vvhirlevvinde ſayde 2 vvho darkeneth ſecretes vvordes vvithout knovvledge 3 girde vp thy loynes like valiant man tell thing ſhall demaunde thee 4 vvhere vvert thou vvhen layde foundation earth tell thou haſte vnderſtanding wee haue ſeene heretofore eliu intending rebuke iob proteſted himſelf mortall man iob end ſhould cō plaine hee handled high power ſo ſhewed god win reaſon gentleneſſe according alſo dealeth towards v beareth v making worde bee preached v men like ſelues ſo may come familiarly heare thing telleth v doctrine chawed put mouthes vve ſee god pitieth v appoynteth men bee miniſters worde teach v name authoritie knoweth abilitie foraſmuch feeble ſhould hand ſwallowed vp maieſtie ouerwhelmed glorie cauſe ſtoupeth downe lowneſſe inſtructing v meanes men yet requiſit alſo ſhould touched yeeld reuerence deſerueth without wee woulde abuſe goodneſſe whereas commeth vnto v ende woulde play haile fellowe wel met reherſed v preſently god perceyuing iob ſufficiently ſubdued matter reaſons eliu alledged maketh feele greatneſſe whirlewind ende therwith put feare ſhould yeeld himſelfe acknowledging fault wholy obey whatſoeuer ſhould bee ſayde ſo ſee god applieth himſelf v faſhions intent win v one wile ſtoupeth downe vnto v bicauſe perceyueth v groſſe rude mount vp vnto neuertheleſſe foraſmuch ouergreat pryde nature behoueth v feele hee ende may learne feare heare worde humilitie diligence point ought mark well therein ſee loue beareth v care hee hath welfare need muſt carefull v doth ye would ſay ſo tranſfigure himſelfe voutſafeth talke familiarly v alſo ſtammer liſpe v hee ſeeth meete conuenient v againe foraſmuch ſeeth goodneſſe might turne contempt hee doth alſo aduaunce magnifie himſelfe meete intent ſhould knowe owne ſtate ſubmit ſelues wholy vnto ſo much ought wee deſire taught worde ſith agreeable capacitie therein god hath ouerſlipt thing requiſite profitable ſaluation seing good god hath vouchſafed ſtoupe downe wiſe vnto v yet therewithall aduaunceth himſelfe frame v obedience let v bee willinger heare ſpeaketh let v make fonde excuce god worde high darke v terrible ſimple ſhall haue well caſt vp account ſhall find certaintie lord ſetteth v forth ſuch maieſtie woorde able make creature quake yet alſo ſimplicitie end make bee receyued moſt ignorant vnskilfull moreouer ſo great light wee may vnderſtand without going ſchoole leaſtwiſe bee teachable without cauſe hee calleth himſelf purpoſely ſchoolemaſter lowly little one thus ye ſee thing wee haue marke firſt ſtreyne god ſpeaking v mouth men intent wee ſhoulde come freely receyue thing better leyſure behalf telleth v aſtoniſhed meaſure howbeit foraſmuch dul vpon ſpurre yeeld honour deſerueth hee maketh v feele exalteth himſelfe maieſtie intent ſame ſhould bring v honour purpoſely ſayde lorde ſpake vnto iob whirlewinde ynough haue giuen ſome token preſence alſo rayſe vehement tempeſt vve ſhall finde scripture ſometimes god rayſed thunder ſame ſort hee liſted ſpeake faythfull one haue ſpecially marke heere circumſtance place forſomuch iob ſufficiently tamed god ſaine ſhewe terrible force cauſe hee thundered rayſed whirlewinde iob ſhoulde know lord deale generall commonly ſayd god dwelleth darke cloud rather compaſſed light therefore cannot come inſomuch woulde looke vpon god ſenſes dazle reaſon thicke darkeneſſe betweene v verie well ſpoken generall glorie god ende wee ſhould preſume bee ouer inquiſitiue incomprehenſible determination taſt ſo farre pleaſeth diſcouer vnto v therewithall conſider ſenſes fayle v vouchſafe come v elſe lift v vp yet neuertheleſſe another reſpect wit bycauſe ſturdineſſe god muſt faine ſhewe himſelfe terrible v true would faine drawe v gentleneſſe ſee men bee well diſpoſed ſubmit themſelues vnto vſeth ſayd louing maner inuiting vntoo gently may perceiueth ſturdineſſe muſt need firſt make v ſtoupe otherwiſe ſhoulde win ſpeaking v cauſe publiſhing lawe hee rayzed thunder blew trumpet ayre made ſhake inſomuch people ſo afrayde ſayd let lorde ſpeake vnto v dead wee vtterly vndone vvhy god ſhake earth maner voyce rore ſuch terribleneſſe ment hee driue away people ſhoulde heare truely cleane contrarywiſe ſayde hee gaue lawe vayne ment giue people certaine rule ende might knowe way lyfe rayſing whirlwindes tempeſts ayre ſcare v ſay part meening ſerueth preparatiue ſubdue loftineſſe thoſe folke would neuer haue obeyed god word neuer haue acknowledged authoritie ſpake without theſe token whiche added therfore let v mark wel god ſpeaking iob faſhion whirlwinde needed nowe ſuch holy man applied whole indeuer honouring god needed bee ſubdued maner wee neede let v compare ſelues iob mirrour angellike holineſſe wee haue heard proteſtations made although extremely afflicted reaſon therof murmure let ſlip many wilde word yet alwayes hold himſelf grounde woorſhipping god humbling himſelfe vnder hand hilde ſtill generall poynt though ſwarued aſide ſome particular bee fleſhly may vanity ſo carie v away bee maner ſtarke drunken hardely wee diſcerne god heauen man ſet woorde afore v make ſlowe haſte yea bee duller aſſes lorde neede make v feele maieſtie touche v good earneſt nowe truely god needeth rayſe vp ſtormes whirlwind make v know ſpeaketh hee muſt diſpoſe v another maner come vntoo according alſo hee doeth one man haue hartbitings trouble conſcience another afflicted diſeaſes thirde bee touched aduerſitie let v vnderſtande god calleth v bycauſe wee come owne accorde drawe neere heare worde ſubdueth ſuch hardhartedneſſe meete ſhoulde ende mindes ſhould humbled true obedience doeth god ſee ſuch rebelliouſneſſe v hee muſte needes vſe maners meanes aforeſayde draw win v himſelfe ende wee may heare hee muſt fayne ſpeake v whirlwinde preuayleth men wee ſee ſome kicke againſt prick play reſtie iades although god quicken vp yet winneth nothing hand many theſe wretch ſeene god chaſtiſeth ſo many wayes ſtri • ing ſo hard blowes vpon heades beetle neuer ſo harde muſt needes bee ſoftned yet notwithſtanding neuer leaue gnaſhing theyr teeth vve ſee cannot trayned neither meanes moued ſo full pride ſtubbornneſſe ſhewe themſelues agaynſt god euen ſpyting vttermoſt theyr power much behoofe thoſe god chaſtizeth diſpoſed come vnto intent therefore let v beware diſappoynt god oft ſendeth v aduerſitie let v learne reſort well though hee ſpake thunder thundered vpon v make v heare let v conſider let v ſo cōſider mindes may truly ſubdued vnto whole ſeeking may bee wholly humbled vnder obeyſance lo haue marke ſtreyne let v marke although god doo theſe dayes thunder heauen yet notwithſtanding ſignes haue bene giuen olde time warranting worde ought ſerue v alſo daye vvhen god lawe preached vnto v wee muſt immediatly match therewithall thing ſpoken ninetenth exodus lawe hath beene duely warranted lorde gaue full authoritie therevntoo hee ſent thunder lightening heauen made ayre ring noyſe trumpet done intent lawe ſhoulde bee receyued reuerence euen worldes ende much imported verſe wheras ſayd god appeared whirlwind behoueth v vnderſtand intent warrant thing conteyned booke muſt alſo extende authoritie vnto whole word yet one thing conſidered god begin call v louing maner ſhew himſelf rough ſharpe end muſt think ſtrange rather examin well life knowe whether wee haue obeyed ſo let v one ſide acknowledge apparant goodneſſe ſide conſider muſt needes vſe ſecond meanes win v hee ſeeth gayneth nothing fauourable dealing hee ſhewed v example god doth ſometimes cocker v intendeth take v owne haue v flocke hee ſetteth foorth worde vnto v without ſending v affliction verie well wee ſee ſo wee like well yet meane profite ſelues bee confirmed goodneſſe wee ought renounce owne wicked luſtes forget worlde giue ſelues wholly vnto hee beareth v time ende ſeeth v ſo retchleſſe beginneth ſmite heerein ought perceyue ſpeaking v whirlwinde without cauſe forſomuch heare ſpake graciouſly vntoo v kindeharted fatherly maner therefore requiſite god ſhould ſpeake v ſuch vehemence ſith hee perceyueth wee neuer come till hee haue prepared v faſhion true hee winneth ſome bare worde howbeeit hee ſeeth otherſome ſtubborne ſendeth ſome trouble aduerſitie doubtleſſe number neuer come goſpell neuer bene touched rightly heart obey god ſent ſome token hee minded chaſtice heerevpon felt affliction nothing wretchedneſſe world inforced miſlike themſelues cut pleaſures wherein bin plunged heeretofore ye ſee god draweth men diuerſe ſortes let v profite ſelues meanes vſeth towards v againe ſpeaketh v whirlwinde let v ſide bee familiar ſuffer ſelues ruled ſheepe lamb ſpie hardhartedneſſe v muſt needes ſubdue v whether although ſuffer v play looce colt time yet length ſhall feele terrible maieſtie make v afrayde leaſtwiſe pleaſe ſhew v fauour god doth v ſingular good turne wakeneth v maner thundereth ſo voyce entereth hart woundeth v ſay priuiledge granteth men againe thūdering vpō vnbeleeuers late hope returning vnto hee ſummoneth thē heare condēnation much ought wee receyue quietly helpe god giueth v ſubduing ſtubbornneſſe oure fleſh rayſeth ſome whirlwind ſay maketh v feele maieſty ye ſee effect haue mark vpon ſentence let v come ſaid theſe wordes darkneth ſecretes wordes without knowledge gird vp thy loynes like valiant man anſwere demaundes firſt place god mocketh iob bicauſe ſtriued borne himſelf hand could mend cace diſputing cauſe ſayd art thou ſcripture ſheweth v make v vtterly nothing true men make great account themſelues beare themſelues hand ſome great woorthineſſe well may eſteeme highly themſelues god meanewhile knoweth nothing al filth ſtinch therfore ſhaketh yea euen lothing ſo although bee ſo fooliſh ouerweening glorie wiſdome vertue v yet notwithſtanding god deface v put v ſhame vſeth word art thou thou art man pronouncing vtter bereeuing v occaſion boaſting wee knowe ſo much one drop goodneſſe v haue wee cauſe vaunt ſelues maner wiſe cauſe alſo god addeth girde vp thy loynes like valiant man ſay set much ſtore thyſelf thou liſteſt beare thy ſelf hand thou art gyant bee thou furniſhed throughly bee thou armed top toe ſhalt thou gaine ende thinkeſt thou ſtande ſet myſelf agaynſt thee thou wretched creature vvhat haſt thou heere ſee god meening ſayde afore fooliſhneſſe ſelfe eſtimation ſelfeweening wee bee ſome value ſo rooted v verie hard bring v right vnderſtanding owne wantes ſo wee might bee cleare pryde preſumption much behoueth v marke text ſcripture ſhewed v thing eſtimation v let v wey well ſpoken ſome one part worlde onely mankinde generall therefore let great ſmall learne bee aſhamed themſelues ſeing god byndeth vp one bundle togither hee ſayeth wiſedome men fooliſhneſſe vanitie ſtrength weakneſſe rightuouſneſſe vncleanneſſe dung god ſpeaketh ſuche termes two three men men vniuerſally therefore let v greateſt leaſt learne ſtoupe acknowledging glorie confuzion ſhame god cauſe let v thinke vpon ſaying let v take bee ment onely perſone iob mortall creature lorde ſhould ſay ſuch malapertneſſe man pot • brittle earth man veſſell ful filth naughtineſſe man leſſe nothing ſuch malapertneſſe diſpute agaynſt mee bee ſo inquiſitiue afore hande whether go vvho art thou ô man according alſo ſee saint paule ſetteth ſame woorde ſtoppe way ſaying vvho art thou ô man whiche reaſoneſt god pleadeſt againſt ſetteth downe hee hath alledged obiections wherein men thinke themſelues haue fayre colour diſpute agaynſt god demaunde ſhould deſtroy thoſe hath created ſhould put difference betwene one another without knowing cauſe ſo one ſhould bee called ſaluation bee reiected saint paul • • athe ſet downe thoſe thing although men take pleaſure ſuch obiections yet ſayth man art thou ſetteſt thy ſelf faſhion againſt god haue marke vpon ſaying therfore whenſoeuer man tempted pride lette thinke himſelfe ala art thou entering battell againſt ſuch ſelues agaynſt match need ſo bold inquiſitiue god ſecretes l • fancy tongue looce imagine vnprofitable thing talke againſt god honour wee muſt faine thinke ala euery v ſhall haue entered himſelfe conſidered owne feebleneſſe perceiued effect nothing ſhall cooled well ynough prittleprattle former conceytes layd water yea imagination brideled imprizoned ſhall declared yet fully hereafter ſayd expreſly gird vp thy loynes like valiant man v wit whole world hath layd force togither vttered ſame nothing ye ſee god ſpiteth defyeth iob bidding furniſh himſelf come armed weaponed gyant valianteſt man could found hereby expreſſeth yet better thing haue ſayde alreadie wit condemning men ſcripture ment ſimply common ſort ſuch deſpiſed credite eſtimation extendeth euen greateſt ſuch thinke touch cloud heades although men imagine themſelues haue ſome apparaunce honour let aſſure themſelues ſame nothing god example excellent compariſon neighbour ſurely conceyue ſome opinion well lyking themſelues man bee counted skilfull good wit good behauiour ſet much ſelfe reſpect thoſe haue ſame quality finally man bee indued great commendable vertues afore men hauing ſuch ſpeciall induements perchaunce make heart hoppe belly ſay ſet much ſtore ſelues come vnto god muſt quite quaile ſo luſtie ſtoute fellow hath cace one whit ſtrength holineſſe wiſdome euer elſe fayleth vtterly behalfe therfore worde let worlde knowe furniture ſhall boote god muſt vtterly deſaced emptied god ſo leaue one drop power ſtrength v wee ſhail take way borrowing acknowledging proceedeth meere goodneſſe ſee worde valiant man importeth doth v wit ſpeciall power vertues ſoeuer wee haue ſame muſt puffe v vp pride agaynſt god furthermore ſayd alſo iob wrappeth darkneth ſecrets wordes without knowledge hereby god ſheweth haue deale ſecrets muſt bethinke ſelues well may proceede ſoberly reuerence vnder worde ſecrets god intended ſignifie high thing wherof iob ſpoken vve may well diſpute many petie trifle yea diſcourſe randon ſo talke ſhall vaine fond yet ſhall blaſphemie neither ſhall god name vnhallowed enter doctrine ſaluation god work fal diſputing prouidence wil thē muſt go ſo vnaduiſedly wrap vp intangle ſecrets vnſkilfull wordes vve ſee wherein god rebuketh iob namely ſpeaking haſtily thing outreached capacitie althogh excellent giftes grace yet ought alwayes haue humbled himſelfe acknowledgement infirmity alſo haue brydeled himſelfe ſith hee well neere wittes wiſt think god iudgements foraſmuch hee felt himſelfe ſuch afterdeale ſhould haue eie feebleneſſe owne vnderſtanding acknowledging ſelf n •• rtall man ſhould haue ſaid ala nothing ignorance fooliſhneſſe herewithal ſhould alſo haue looked vp ineſtimable maieſtie incomprehenſible purpoſe god ſhoulde haue meekned howbeeit neither one thē ▪ although quite ſtrayd right way went forwarde ſtill true marke yet doo wee ſee hee rebuked god owne mouth text putteth v mind reuerence god haue v beare myſteries thing concerne heauenly kingdome reaſon owne matter need go ſo preciſe carefulneſſe earthly thing paſſe away whenſoeuer wee fall talking god workes truth thing conteyned worde muſt come reuerence feare open lippes fluſh whatſoeuer commeth tung end • orhaue witts buſie inquire thing belong v lawful v muſt reſtreyne deſyres brydle tongue ſecretes god ſay darke high thing v meddle therfore muſt think atteyne furtherfoorth god liſteth inſtruct v owne mere goodneſſe woulde god thing wel put vre ſhould haue bickering nowadays whole world ſeene verie fewe touched maieſtie god vvhen wee treate worde doctrine ſaluation holy scripture euerie one falles aduenture euery man ſhootes forth verdit though reaſoned mooneſhine water ſuch thing paſſe vnderſtanding man yet notwithſtanding manifeſt bolder treate god ſo high myſteries ought rauiſh oure wittes wonder ought honor awefulneſſe ſay wee bolder babble thē mā ſpake matter fiue ſhillings value ſome trifle wote cauſe men haue conſidered howe god hydeth ouercaſteth owne ſecrete determination hath holy ſcripture vttered vnto v wherevntoo behoueth v bee ſubiect vve ſee one ſide howe papiſts blaſpheme god wreſting falſifying marring corrupting whole holy scripture ſo ſticke ſcorne god woorde neuer taſted woorde ſecrete meeneth alſo drunkard among v coulde find hart ſubdue god fantaſticall minde though wiſeſt men worlde beſt ſeene holy ſcripture yet ſhould bee fayne come poynt god ſecrete determination aboue v vtterly dull brutiſh neither skill reaſon wine ouermayſtreth lyke ſwine yet needes playe diuines controll thing ſuch wiſe man ſhoulde nowe adayes beleeue hee ſhoulde driuen frame forge newe goſpell therfore let v remember ſhewed v heere wee talke god wee muſt take libertie pleade babble wee oure ſelues thinke good conſider hath reueled ſecretes vntoo v holy scripture bothe greate ſmall muſt ſubmit themſelues therevntoo honour cauſe heere mention made wordes without knowledge nowe god ſheweth v heere whenſoeuer wee ſpeake workes matter ſecrecie high matter ſide bring forth little wee conceyue vnderſtanding woordes without knowledge let men put themſelues balance ſhall bee found lighter vanitie ſelfe ſayde pſalme much behoueth v marke doctrine neither skill aptneſſe v treate god workes except hee teach v way v become wiſe gouerned ſpirit word god therfore finde thing god worde deſire knowe let v vnderſtand behoueth v abide ignorant therevpon keepe mouthes ſhet whenſoeuer go ſpeake ſhall knowledge thing vntruth v accuſation god ſetteth downe heere agaynſt iob thervpon ſayth anſwere demaundes leaſtwiſe thou haue vnderstanding make alſo vnderstande woulde knowe thee heere god proceedeth mocking fooliſh ouerweening men weene themſelues ſo fine witted able diſpute pleade agaynſt therefore ſayth verie well doubt verie able men owne ſeeming ſpeake let raunge alſo muſt haue turne ſpeake replie vpon mee ſhall well ſee default vvhat cauſe men ſo raſhe aduaunce themſelues ſo fooliſhly againſt god take libertie ſpeake occupie place bearing themſelues hand god hath nothing reply againſt beholde remedie god giueth v abate fooliſh raſhneſſe thinke v hee may demaund god begin queſtion v ſhall wee anſwere surely bare thing well minde wee ſhould vtterly reſtreyned although mindes verie egre owne ſeeming wee bee able remoue whole worlde yet ſhould wee bee brought home owne ſtate followe thing ſimply lorde ſheweth v condicionally ſay think ſelues ala come god mouth open well hath authoritie maiſterſhippe queſtion v ſhall anſwere vnto ye ſee wherevnto behoueth v come thing haue conſider text rightly inſtructed foraſmuch haſtie ſpeake ſay foraſmuch haue naturally vice thruſting ſelues forwarde becommeth v let v learne reſtrayne tongue cauſe runne libertie fluſhe thing wee skill conſider dutie rather anſwere god put foorth ſelues ſpeake peruerting order nature mortall man nothing ſhoulde incroch vpon maker cauſe audience bee giuen himſelfe god meanewhile ſhoulde holde hys peace vvhat dealing yet withſtanding oft murmure againſt god teare worde peeces caſt foorth wordes randon ſay thus thus doeth ſeeme mee vvhat cauſe hereof woulde put god ſilence haue ſelues heard aboue ſtarke madneſſe therefore correct ſtatelineſſe v let v learne preſume anſwere god knowing come hath authoritie examine v yea euen according owne oure lyking appoyntment ſhall toto much ſhame ſhall haue ſtopped mouth begon ſpeake ſelfe vvhereof god examine v thing hidden v wherein wittes faile v lo wherevnto god bringeth v ſhewe v beaſtlineſſe frentike preſumption seeing god hathe ſuch queſtions put v able alledge thing ſhall confounded let v learne ſo humble ſelues may learne hand haue lerned may make v ſee light middes darkeneſſe worlde meane ſeaſon let v learne alſo ſerue honour reſpectes poynts ſhall haue profited well god ſchoole ſhall haue learned magnifie yeelde ſuch glorie haue good opinion proceedeth moreouer let v alſo miſlike ſelues ende wee may reſort vnto finde goodneſſe wanteth ourſelues therevpon may pleaſe ſo gouerne v holy ſpirite repleniſhed glorie wee may haue whereof glorie ſelues onely nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele wee may returne true repentance thervpon vouchſafe ſo reforme whole life whole ſeeking may bee ſubmit ſelues holy commaundements ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confeſſe c cxlviij sermon ſecond vpon xxxviij chapter 4 vvherevvaſt thou vvhen layde foundation earth ſhevve mee thou haſt vnderſtanding 5 vvho hath layde meaſures thereof canſt thou tell vvho hath ſet compaſſe vpon 6 vvherevpon foundation thereof ſtayed vvho hee hath layde cornerſtone thereof 7 vvhen starres morning reioyced togither child god ſoong triumph 8 vvho hath ſhettevp sea vvithin doores vvhich emptying ſelfe commeth foorth vvombe 9 vvhen made clovvdes garment thereof darkneſſe ſvvadling bandes thereof 10 haue ſtabliſhed mine ordinance vpon haue ſhet vp vvithin barres doores 11 ſayde hither ſhalt thou come paſſe heere ſhalt thou ſtay lifting vp thy vvaues graunt well ynough reherſed concerning god work wee ſee bothe heauen earth wee minded earneſtly coulde hardly made ſpeake one worde neuerthe leſſe wiſt howe profite ſelues thing conteyned doctrine woulde bee ynough teach v lowlineſſe ſo wee ſhoulde open mouthes grudge agaynſt god complayne hee doeth thing lyking geere woulde layde awater incomparable greatneſſe highneſſe oure god hys woonderfull power might infinite goodneſſe wiſe dome whiche ſhewe themſelues woorkes woulde ſuffiſe humble v make v aſtoniſhed wee woulde nothing honour homage feare reuerence vvee haue two thing conſider heere one god ſpeaketh power therewithall ſheweth v face euen thing may ſee ſame needeth conſider thing il though neuer ſo manifeſt v ſecondly behoueth v come end intent god purpoſeth ynough v confeſſe god made earth ſetled middes ſea true god ſhetting vp ſea ſort though incloſed great walles wonderfull thing good right ought wee confeſſe workmaiſter excellent howbeit behoueth v paſſe yet applie whole indeuer glorifie god ſuch wiſe confeſſe doings bee iuſt full equitie right meanes bee bridled bee tempted grudge repine finde fault workes let thing conteyned heere ſerue ſubdue v holde v ſuch humbleneſſe modeſtie wee may doo nothing elſe honour reaſon workes bee vnknowne v let v therefore ceaſſe take good rightfull reſt therevpon without gaynſaying let v come word conteyned firſt queſtion god demaundeth iob layd foundation earth ſhuld ſay wretched creature againſt doſt thou ſet thyſelf would behoue thee firſt bee match would behoue thee come neere mine vnderſtanding howe farre art thou againe ſayeth come let ſee thou hast vnderstanding bath layde meaſures earth tellmee if▪ thou knoweſt hath ſet compaſſe vpon ſame make ſo well proportioned hath ſetled earth vpon hir corner whervpon ſtayde iob tell theſe thing ſayeth god truly wee beholde greatneſſe weightineſſe earth wee bee abaſhed hougeneſſe dazeleth witts able comprehend vve ſee well ynough wee bee conſtreyned confeſſe made great reaſon bee yet come ſhort wherin god ſheweth v frailtie feebleneſſe noweſeeing ſo euen thing ſeene eye wee want ſufficient iudgement comprehende pray ſhall god narrow hidden ſecretes whereby hee ordeyneth appoynteth hee liſteth heauen wee eſpie reaſon thereof ſhall ſay meete v ſo ſelfe wiſe iudge fancie ſeeing ſurmount vnderſtanding shall comprehend verie angel cannot comprehende ouergreat folly rather madneſſe men preace ſo farre let v well aduiſed purpoſe ſayde better vnderſtanding therof let v make compariſon take mee maſons carpenter worlde yea cunningeſt builder bee chozen yet neyther maſon carpenter ſo excellent art hee neede lyne compaſſes rule plummet ſuch lyke thing buylde withall elſe building bee crooked ſhall raiſe twoo pole highe without ſome fault nowe thoſe woorkmayſters howe cunning excellent ſo euer theyr art faine helpe themſelues lynes compaſſes meaſures yet greateſt palace caſtels ſhall bee ſo builded hundred pole high compariſon building earth ſea man ſhall curſtly combered hee intende make caſtle hewen ſtone firſt good foundation ſure groundworke
