building vayne layd vpon againe reering bee good proportion order working wel borne pray palace caſtles put togither compariſon ſea lande vvhat proportion betweene one seeing men bee neuer ſo cunning haue neede helpes ſeeke heere ayde ſuccour yea euen thing nothing cō pariſon moſt excellent houge woorkmanſhip appeareth earth alone god hath ſo ſetled vpon water ſee made ſo goodly order muſt need worſe thā witleſſe take vpon v controll god thoſe doings farre beyond cōpariſon hidden v thing ſeene order nature therefore whenſoeuer theſe thing come remembrance let ſerue rauiſh v wonderment glorifie hath made ſuch building onely long continuance time vvee ſee men cannot firſt day builde make perfect thing go hande fayne beſtow much labour time ſo god ſee hee quickly finiſh goodly workmanſhip ſeene heauen earth bee ſhort ſee heere god mocketh men pride preſume controll work ſpake ſome meane worke ſuch cunning maſonrie carpenter craft ſhould ſay better thus thus ſo would play mayſtermaſon yet haue skill matter ſhoulde maiſtermaſons carpenter haue iuſt cauſe laugh mee ſcorne ſay fellow skill make windowe halfe foote ouer yet hee falles controlling v vvill skilfull art take ſcorne man ſhould come ſo fooliſhly control workmanſhip wil ſend ouerweener backe againe apcee yes ſurely nowe ſtande ſuch awe maiſtermaſons carpenter wee dare ſpeake woorke modeſty proteſtation vnable iudge ſhall come vnto god behoueth v bee much humble modeſt vve know maner men ſpeake handicraft workmanſhip craftſmen themſelues true ſay ſeene occupation trade neuertheleſſe ye ſhal heare mine aduice howbeeit referre ſtill wholly ſuch haue skill wee vſe ſuch modeſtie ſtandeth vpon iudging building ſomeother meane worke handicraft mannes making pray honour ought yeeld vnto god cace concerneth workes eſtimation ought haue ſee god intended text ſpeaking line compaſſe ſhould ſay mortal corruptible creature yet would men beholding workes honor ſay beholde excellent skilfull workman cunning worke ſpeakes yea ſome handicraftes man ſayde afore done ſome meane peece work men would ſo bold find fault leaſtwiſe would vnderſtāding ſuch workmanſhip haue made ſo excellent worke haue created heauen earth ſea nothing haue finiſhed ſo goodly order aray men ſee men take vpon neuertheleſſe controll dealing vvhat work men layd workmanſhip shall come neere mine haue wrought incomprehenſible power wiſedome yet ſhall bee free mennes iudgements shall man dare ſay doeſt thou doeſt thou better thee doo ſo ſo vvhat pride shall men preferre mortall creature mee liuing god almightie alwiſe intollerable vnthankefulneſſe mortall manne make peece woorke men doo honour iudge without great modeſtie haue deſerued bee honored hundred tymes haue builded worlde let v learne looke better vpon god woorkes haue done ſo wee caſt eye vpon earth wee may bethinke v terrible hougeneſſe thereof ſome great caſtell well wrought wherevnto none commeth neere ſee weight hath inſomuch may well ſeeme impoſsible foundation bee founde able beare vp wherevpon grounded euen vppon water earth muſte needes hang ayre doeth deede hathe water rounde aboute truely euen philoſophers conſidered god maker thereof well perceyue reaſon howe water compaſſe earth whole maſſe togither hangeth ayre haue diſputed verie curiouſly thereof alledged ſome reaſon yet conſtreyned ſpite theyr teeth graunt thing aboue nature ſay water ſhoulde ſo ſhrinke aſide intent men might haue roome dwell coulde come ſelfe needes muſt working ſome diuine prouidence maner ſpake although blinded owne vnthankefulneſſe yet neuertheleſſe coulde denie ſo howbeeit haue ſayde ynoughe acknowledge god created earth wee muſte alſo beholde woonderfull wiſedome therein acknowledge ſuch myracle wittes come ſhort vvheras ſaid god created nothing hath ſettled earth vpon water thing rauiſh v wonderment wee looke round v ſhal ſee water inuiron whole earth yet notwithſtanding wee ſee earth abideth ſtable myracle true ſometymes men ſhall ſee earthquake ſeeme ſhould go wreck ſo alſo might come paſſe god prouided howſoeuer worlde go wee ſee bodie whole earth ſtandeth ſtedfaſt ſtill wonder v excuce pretend find leyſure thinke vpon ſuch worke god doeth vtter power mightineſſe therein ſo many wayes muſt need ſufficiently conuicted therby ſee ſee one whit magnifie god work lewdneſſe vnexcuſable men fall aſleepe heere take paine thinke vpon god work worſe vnthankfull churliſh howe ignorant ſoeuer none excuſe v wee alwayes blame woorthie glorifie god workes ſo open manifeſt ye ſee wee haue beare mynde ſtreyne nowe way whereas mention made compaſſes meaſuring earth ſee well needed wonderfull power incomprehenſible wiſdome ſetting theſe thing order earth woulde neuer haue ſettled ſtood ſtill doeth middle ayre ſuche iuſt meaſure proportion ſuche conueniencie temperature nothing amiſſe furthermore wee beholde greate farre diſtance onely betweene earth clowdes alſo betweene skie starres planet ſhould abaſhed conſider highneſſe wee ſee skie aboue earth earth greate maſſe weightie houge men ſee bee compare greatneſſe heauen muſt wee needes confeſſe philoſophers little ball vvhat proportionableneſſe betweene one yet neuertheleſſe wee looke vpon mountaynes earth wee ſhall finde euen whereat maruell wherefore glorifie woorkemayſter made againe ſide behold ſteddineſſe earth ought rauiſhe v woonderment althoughe wee ſee great varietie yet doeth alwayes abyde place without fleeting ye ſee high mountaynes doo imboſſe earth vnleuelneſſe place ſeeme able ſhake yea ouerturne quite cleane god hath peyſed earth ſuch proportion meaſure keepeth alwayes owne place ſtill although ſeeme mountaynes ſhoulde ouerſway yet notwithſtanding one ſo anſwerable another counterpeyſe abydeth alwayes ſtedfaſt ſhort whatſoeuer betydeth earth ſhall ſtande ſtedfaſt bee preſerued ſtill ende proportionable euenleueled counterpeyſe ſelfe ſhall bee whit remoued whatſoeuer happen neuertheleſſe wee ſee howe inuironed water houge mountaynes aduaunce themſelues tumble ſea yet notwithſtanding continueth ſteddie ſtill muſt need ſayde god hath wrought paſsing woonderfull faſhion behalfe yes certainly vvhat done onely woorſhip god confeſsing ſelues come farre ſhort ſo houge greatneſſe ſo incomprehenſible wiſedome truth good reaſon ſhoulde walk humbleneſſe feare come conſidering god woonderfull workes ſhewe themſelues euerie order nature ſo wee ſee verie cleerely conteyned heere yet notwithſtanding behoueth v come backe poynt namely god ſetteth earth v looking glaſſe ende wee might beholde infinite glorie wiſedome power might guide v leade v hande conſidering woorkes whiche exceeding greate excellent thereby bee rauiſhed woonderment purpoſe humble ſelues vnder incomprehenſible greatneſſe honour vvee ſee god adorneth himſelfe ſo excellently replying agaynſt entering intoo ſuch boldneſſe deſyre controll though hee done amiſſe vvho hee ſhall comprehende infinite highneſſe let v open eye wee ſhall bee confounded ſide wee looke earth foſtermother feedeth cheriſheth v yet notwithſtanding wee wote howe vve ſee well ynough howe tilled tell well ynough howe talke yet muſt wee needes bee aſtoniſhed euen behalfe concluſion text seing haue mirrour god incomprehenſible power wiſedome euen verie earth wee treade vpon ſhall wee haue wee looke vp heauen farre aboue whereunto able atteyne meete v reply agaynſt god aske doth ſo ſo ſuffereth thing ala let v marke well haue looked well vpon earth ought ſerue hold affection awe ende wee attempt aduance ſelues aboue sky rather yeeld glorie oure god thing pleaſeth knowing ſoueraine god hath perfect ſubſtantiall glorie woonderfull power might matched infinite rightfulneſſe wiſedome ſo fault bee found conceiue well ſhall haue profited greatly one day let v come ſaid ſtarres ſung prayſes child god reioyced triumph creating worlde theſe wordes god betokeneth ſoone ſtarres made ſette ſong melodie glorifie ſtarres ſung ſenſible creature ſomuch god therin ſet owne greatneſſe goodneſſe power wiſedome one ſpoken lowd ſhirle lift vp eye heauen vve muſt needes heare melodie ſtarres according began ſing creation worlde ſurely ſuch melodie ought right waken v ſtirre v vp ſing lordes prayſes glorifie yea though ſtarke deafe yet ought wee giue eare ſo melodious ſongs receyue behold euen angelles heauen prouoked ſo wee bee blockiſh behalfe inſomuch lift vp eye heauenwarde behold ſtarres wee conſider purpoſe ſhoulde ſerue v yet notwithſtanding behoueth v applie text inſtruction end may fare better ſayd firſt part ſtarres began ſing theyr firſt creation maner haue tolde alreadie tongue ſenſleſſe dumbe creature goodneſſe power wiſedome god whiche ſhyne foorth ſtarres ought ſerue v many ſongs ayre rung ſhirle cleare voyces wee ought ſtirred glorifie god wee ſee woonderfull order hee hath ſet eye howbeeit moue v yet better glorifie ſayd angel reioyced ſight hearing ſuch melodie ſpeechleſſe creature ſo muche made triumph hereby ought bee moued glorifie god ſuch ioy ſhall bee right true ioy farre one ioy theſe madde worldelings vnthrifts cannot merry diſpleaſing god vve ſee farre gladneſſe ſet afore v angel heauen leape ioy ſawe excellent courſe wonderfull order heauen god appointment moued ſuch reioycing mencioned heere seeing angelles guide v glorifying god ſinging prayſes vnto ought glad beholde goodly order skie poynt wherevnto wee ought come oft lift vp eye aloft bee farre putting thing vre wee bee exhorted heere truly heare text doctrine ſlippeth away although warned neuer ſo muche ought glorifie god looking vp heauen reioycing lighte sunne although ſufficiently put minde yet doth ſlip v ſeing cheef ſeruice god requireth men prayſed hand make none account whiche woorſe doo rob honour diſfeate glorifie deſerueth ſurely wee ſhall pay deerly commeth reckening true lord knoweth well ynough hee cannot drawe thing v whereby magnified worthie yet contented men ſhould exalt glorifie work ſhould moued prayſe beholding wee ſo wee woorſe traytours yes doubtleſſe wee let v learne profit doctrine conteyned way let v marke angel termed god child ende wee ſhould perſuaded runne triumphe ſpoken heere ioyne triumphing god prayſes glorifying one common accord wee heare ſayde melodie aboue beneath inaſmuche god hath ſpred glory euery truely title beeing termed child god graunted angelles ſpeciall priuiledge bicauſe approch neere vnto haue ſuche nobleneſſe bee aboue creature god meſſangers alſo called principality power bicauſe hāds executeth whatſoeuer thinketh good beholde angel ſurely child god yet called ſo well vvhy ſo bicauſe god created v owne image likeneſſe although defaced ſinne adam yet repayred agayne chozen comming lord ieſus chriſt liuely image god ſo exalted ſpirite ſet former ſtate againe ieſus chriſt hath done v honour come line abraham ſay clothe himſelfe nature ende reconcyle v god father ſeing ſo let v marke god ſheweth v text ſort may bee ſure child cōſequently poſſeſſe heauenly heritage ordeined v well v angel paradiſe although creepe vpon earth creature ſo wretched fraught infirmity may aſhamed want wretchedneſſe yet god finde meanes couple v angel heauen heerewithall let v vnderſtande angelles tremble beholde heauen earth although excellent creature yet driuen bee abaſſhed beholding ſuche ſighte heauen earth ſeeing angel ſo excellent aboue men bee neuertheleſſe abaſhed greatneſſe god ought wee bee rauiſhed woonderment wee open eye behold god woonderfull woorkes wee heare goodly melodie woorks ala ſhould ſo vnthankfull ſhet eye wee myght ſee nothing shoulde wee playe deafe men wee myght heare nothing lette v followe angel ſet foorth v guide intent god myght bee glorified handes wee glorifie woorkes take auowe v child ſhewe himſelfe alwayes father towards v thus ye ſee haue cōſider vpon ſentence ſayde god child reioyced triumphe ſawe ſtarres morning reioycing togither purpoſely ſayd ende myght know ſuch giue mindes earneſtly magnifying god power whiche hee vttereth woorkes ſhall cut houſe vnwoorthie reckened number child nowe let v paſſe lorde commeth sea vvho hath ſet barres ſayeth hee sea hath ſhet vp within barres doores thou ſhalt paſſe thus farre ſhalt thou come vvhen ſea ſwelleth ſeemeth ſhould drowne ſwallow vp yet notwithſtanding ſee whyle pryſon yea god holdeth nource ſhoulde holde little babe▪ hee hath ſet clowdes miſtes ſea little ſwadling band garment couer ſea thē ſeemeth litle babe whome god weeldeth liſteth heerein alſo continueth magnifying woorkes ſhewevs ſuch excellencie ought ſuffiſe make v walke humbleneſſe ſo bolde ſet vp briſtles agaynſt according alſo ſpeaketh prophete ieremie feare ye mee ſayeth hee haue ſet bound ſea ſayeth bycauſe sea aboue v true ſimple ignorant perceyue sea ouerpeareth v higher earth ſuppoze water vnder earth farre beneathe cleane contrarye wee bee neere sea wee ſee perceyue euen eyeſight hygher earth nowe ſeeing ſea ſo aboue v whereof long wee bee ſwallowed vp euerye minute houre ſeeing water mounteth farre aboue heades ſpecially mention made fludde drowne whole earth ſayde god opened ſprings windowes heauen alſo hee opened deepes ſo water reſtreyned let looce dreadfull iudgement fludde god ſhewed v mirrour thing ſhould continually vpon earth hilde water miracle vvee ſee ſea ſhoulde ouerwhelme letteth see yee open miracle wee conuicted woorſe churles cauſe v worſhippe god feare according power ſo hee may haue ſouerayntie ouer v vtterly beaten downe men preſume ſet vp briſtles ſo againſt god let picke quarell ſea ſee ſhall heard aboue elſe sea greate ſurges hideous waues ſigne power made nowe waues sea aſtoniſh v ala much terrible muſte maieſtie god v vvhen sea caſteth vp boylings ſuch hideouſneſſe ſee wee tremble ſhall wee feare maker rather bleare tongue vvhat dealing muſt nedes ſayd men ſtarke madde cauſe god vpbraydeth men prophet ieremie according haue alledged text ſaying feare ye mee mee haue bounded ſea ſands euerlaſting ordinance let v come againe word placed heere god ſayeth hath bounded sea thoſe boundes like erewhile made mention compaſsing earth ſo nowe ſpeaketh ſea yea maner bound better expreſsing ſayd addeth sea hande little babe wombe mother ſo child lieth ſtil mother wombe doth sea within bound true maketh great noyſe ſpecially toſſed windes tempeſtes ſwell ſeemeth world ſhall ouerwhelmed yet paſſe beyond bound reſtreyneth like weſee miracle child kept cloſe mother woombe graue howeſoeuer hee fare yet hee getteth till day byrthtyme fully expyred according common order nature euen ſo sea beſides god addeth yet another ſimilitude mistes ſerue reſtreyne sea ſhoulde paſſe boundes border like swadlingban • e keepe yong babe childe woulde fayne pull oute armes legges make ſport ſo hild ſwadlingclothes hee fayne tarye like pryſoner euen ſo sea ryſeth ſuche wiſe would likelyhoode onely leape one place another rather haue ſayde already ſwallow vp put whole worlde confuſion vve ſee ſea fareth ſo ther cheyne reſtreyne headyneſſe wee ſee although neede bee greate lettes ſhoulde reſtreyne ſo furiouſe creature yet dooth god vſe violent meanes ſtay hath appoynted mystes holde backe therby ſee handleth little babe according owne ſaying proofe thereof wee ſee miſtes nothing vapoures ingendred ayre wonder ſame ſhould get vpper hande sea ſo ſoone myſte ryſeth sea becommeth calme vvhereof commeth nothing vvhat ſhall man ſay sea little babe tyed vp swadlingcloutes although theſe ſimilitudes ſeeme verie ſtraunge firſte bluſh yet notwithſtanding impoſsible finde fitter kindes ſpeache make v perceyue incomprehenſible maieſtie god vve neede mount vp maieſtie knowe woonderfull workes ſetteth dayly eye proue greatneſſe highneſſe ſo ſufficiently wee cannot denie fowle ſhame v wee acknowledge incomprehenſible power ſayde heere sea reſtreyned myſtes little babe hilde swadlingclothes though sea bee hideous men ſee yet hilde within bound may well leape mount aloft cannot paſſe therefore let v learne glorifie god wonderous woorkes better let v aſhamed carliſh vnthankfulneſſe towards acknowledging goodneſſe power wiſedome myght yeelde prayſe belongeth thervpō let v returne god principall intent whiche wee muſte ſtay vpon ſea conſider thing ſimplie ſelfe true men myghte take ſome good inſtruction beholding howe god reſtreyneth sea ſwallowing v vp vvhen know euery v conuicted life god giueth v giuen myracle yet ynough wee went behold god ſheweth v wonder maketh v perceyue theſe viſible thing notwithſtanding ſo high dazeled nowe conſtrayned honour acknowledging wittes weake comprehend highneſſe thing ſene eye ſhal incomprehenſible ſecretes priuy hidden determination generally particularly hee woorketh ſuch faſhion ſeemeth ſtraunge v farre outreacheth capacitie becommeth v preſume cace iudge aduenture giue verdit vpon though wee able comprehend thing doth ſo beyonde wit capacitie ſendeth many aduerſities miſeries one man looſeth good another ſmitten ſickneſſe another falles reproche ſlaunder another wronged beaten might thought god far ouerſeene handling men ſo roughly ſo theſe thing behooueth v learne confeſſe god alwayes rightuous knoweth cauſe handle v ſo ſame cauſe good rightfull though vnknowne v acknowlege yet foraſmuch ſtill hande ſhall gayne nothing grudgings wee ſee wieked vngodly haue full ſcope worlde ſee deſpiſers god liue eaſe ſee credit authoritie maiſters lord worlde ſee ſpite god dayly yet notwithſtanding puniſhed firſte brunt ſee contrary part wee fayne indure one whyle ſhame another whyle trouble another bee intrapped treaſon god ſuccoureth v ſo ſoone would haue let v wayt paciently till god deliuer v knoweth expedient v therewithall let v vnderſtande wonder thing doth bilow euen owne perſons thing may beholde feete much reaſon ſhoulde wonder yea honour ſecrecie ſurmounteth euen capacitie angelles therefore let theſe lower thing teach v ſettle ourſelnes magnifying glorifying god ſo long ſhal world let v ſuffer ourſelues guided gouerned holy ſpirite ende may order v good pleaſure let v fal downe preſence good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue doone ſpecially knowe ſuch frayltie v faile point wit ſo rude groſſe cannot attaine glorie thereby may learne vtterly caſt downe ourſelues yet ceaſſe ſeeke bee lifted vp fayth good god namely ſo bee alwayes ſobreneſſe modeſtie knowing howe muche wee beholding bounde vntoo number benefites beſtoweth vpon v dayly may ſtirred vp yea wholly inflamed yeld thankes example poore ignorant misbeleuing ſoules may drawne one ſelfſame fayth knowledge truth ſo men may one common accord praiſe magnifie exalte hee deſerueth bringing heereof paſſe may pleaſe rayſe vp true faithfull miniſters worde c cxlix sermon third vpon xxxviij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon 8 9 10 11 verſes vpon text added 12 haſt thou ſince dayes commaunded breake day haſt thou appointed light place 13 myght take holde corner earth vvicked myght bee ſhaken 14 transformed clay vvhereon marke ſet holde themſelues garment 15 light ſhall hidden vvicked arme lifted vp ſhall broken 16 haſte thou entered intoo deepe vvaters sea haſt thou ſearched bottome depthes 17 gate death knovvne vnto thee haſt thou ſeene gate ſhadovv death thing cauſeth men iudge foliſhly god work make muche haſte tarry ende might know god hath prouided thing ſo v put prouerbe vre haſt maketh waſt therfore haue need refraine ſelues haſty caſting forth iudgemēt aforehand thereof thing ought well warne v whiche ſpoken concerning sea wee loke vpō moūting vp waues ſemeth ſhold ouerwhelme worlde ſhould ſwallowed vp perchaunce ſay god ought haue remedied waues retire agayne breake thēſelues cannot paſſe bound perceiue god wōderfull wiſdome power better foraſmuch ſee although ſea ruſh foorth ſuche headineſſe yet notwithſtanding holdeth back man ſhould weeld litle babe declared yeſterday able comprehend god workes p ••• ection ſhall haue wherfore glorifie reſpectes fall ſhooting foorth iudgement poſt haſte woont raſhneſſe ſhewe ſelfe confuzion ſhall befall v ouerboldneſſe therfore let v beare wel minde ſayde heere god hath giuen sea lawe ſay thou ſhalt go thus farre ſea euer calme neuer ſtorme tempeſt men ſhold ſo well perceiue god prouidence fatherly care whiche hath men maintaine hath planted whē ſea hath leaue lift vp ſelfe ſo high mightily yet cannot paſſe bound reſtreyned ordinance god therby may perceine god hath diſpozed thing good meaſure reaſon may extended whē ſee warres moued ſeemeth thing high lowe ſhoulde bee mingled togither wee woulde condemne god lay power elſe wee fall iangling againſt ſuffring thing go maner tary end paciently ſhal perceiue one ſide god chaſtizeth men iuſtlye ſtyrring vp warres among ſide thereby hee intendeth ſhewe power fire ſo kindled ſhall anone quenched minute houre doeth god execute office wherof ſayd xlvj pſalme belongeth breake ſpeares knap aſunder ſwoordes ouerthrow chariot appeaſe thing againe ſo troubled afore vvee muſte haue god ordinance alwayes eye mind whereby hee ſo guydeth gouerneth trouble ſeeme tend euill end turneth altogither vnto good god thinketh ynough cure miſchefe alſo vſeth good end inſomuch driuen confeſſe much better v theſe trouble ſhoulde happen ſhoulde alwayes liue peace reſt therefore conſider well cauſes whiche moue god ſende ſuch trouble worlde murmure againſt although conceiue thē yet let v therfore ceaſſe honor reuerētly ſecret determination god kepeth himſelf let vstary leyſure paciently acknowledging owne ſmall capacitie rudeneſſe ſhall folow rule giuen v according ſaide hast thou thy dayes commaunded morning light hast thou made knowe place ought come forth heere lorde proceedeth mocke men pride take vpon thē iudge ſaying long ſince borne vvas light day seeing ye ſo wiſe find fault mee much ſay order world borne morning light wiſt whence come whither go without bin orderlineſſe nothing bin made bin sith ye thinke ſelues ſo wiſe needes control aske whether haue time appointed frō whence light ſhall ariſe although ye neuer yet ſtil finding ſault doings haue alwayes ſet difference betwixt light darkneſſe euer ſince beginning worlde haue appoynted night tyme darkeneſſe cauſed breake day come foorth pleaſure haue ſet euerlaſting order ought bee wonderfull ye churliſh ye could confeſſe theſe thing excellent nowe done borne aunceters yea euen man created meane fall controlling mee vvhy ſet vp briſtles againſt recken yeres little world hath continued haue gouerned hitherto yea ſuche wiſe creature muſte nedes cōfeſſe aſtoniſhed ſight ſhew yet ſeeming haue done nothing time ye knowe howe light ſhould diſpoſed draw darkneſſe wiſe yee weene ſelues bee heere firſt lorde bringeth v backe birth hee ſhoulde ſay recken yeares howe long ago ſince yee came worlde beholde men snayles aſſoone bee borne death threatneth thē go god graunt liue tyme heere doo make walke ſayde fourſcore tenth pſalme muſt backe againe haue made twoo three • urnes leaped like frog god draweth away himſelf yet notwithſtāding euen ſuch ſhortneſſe life whiche paſſeth winde ſlippeth away incontinently men rottenneſſe needes contend go lawe theyr maker dealing lette men conſider little euerlaſtingneſſe therfore ſoeuer tempted ſo buzy aforehand god work let v conſider time lēgth ſince borne time life haue ſcarcely lifted vp eye vnto heauen conſider whit euerlaſtingneſſe god contrariwiſe ſhortneſſe owne life bethought ſelues throughly would ſoone ſtop mouthes wit ſhoulde ſhet vp ſo woulde meanes go murmur agaynſt god nowe let v compare life long continuance world yet muſt paſſe wit god continued himſelf maieſty world made sith ſo let v learne referre ourſelues wholly knowing intollerable thing ſhold ſo paſſe boūds deſire raūge iudging thing knowe one point haue marke vpon ſaying haste thou thy dayes commaunded breake day created god hath already ſet thing order yea ſo well ſhall purpoſe carpe vvherefore let v humble ſelues ſeing god ſuch fatherly care v ſent v worlde prouided thing neceſſarie v aforehande furthermore whereas mētion made morning light let v therin acknowledge god infinite wiſdome power therwithall inured ſee breake day ſhold ſore afrayde hauing ſeene darkneſſe daunte dull v afore ſodaynly turning hande wee ſee whole worlde ſo inlightned vvoulde ſay impoſsible wee acquainted wee eſteeme god working knowne vnto v woontedneſſe whiche hee gyueth v bringing v vnthankefulneſſe ſelfe thorough naughtineſſe vvherefore without cauſe dooth god ſay whē man looketh vpon morning light muſt needes abaſhed conſider whence commeth although eaſt ſtandeth alwayes one certayne coaſte yet notwithſtanding men ſee sunne riſeth ſometimes higher ſometimes lower according ſeaſons yeare vvinter time bycauſe sunne ſomewhat v hee riſeth coaſt againe sommer time draweth neere v ſo riſeth higher higher till ſeeme bee almoſte ouer heades ſhorte like eaſt ſo alſo morning light ſeeing ſuch order ſet payre compaſſes ſo sunne ſwarueth one hearebreadth circuite god hath appoynted commeth alwayes iumpe poynt thing may well woonder vvee ſee sunne neuer goeth way inſomuche man marke thing well hee ſhall finde diuerſitie euery daye yeare yet notwithſtanding compare one thing another yea euen whole yeare ſhall perceyue goeth one continuall race ſo though sunne ryſe one poynt sky day another morow likewiſe ſet yet yeare commes returneth agayne followe ſame trace whiche hee hath continued euer ſince making worlde keeping orderly courſe ſuch wiſe man nothing neere make clocke keepe ſo iuſte compaſſe sunne doeth going aboute maſſe thing much greater whole earth agayne verie muche hee greater race go throughout whole yeare goeth one day yet neuertheleſſe ſeeing keepeth order ſo iuſt thing ought rauiſhe v woonderment might honour incomprehenſible maieſtie god yes wee woorſe brute beaſtes vvee haue eye ſee god maketh dumbe creature ſounde imprinting glory heare nothing melodie long nothing oure owne naughty lewdneſſe take hold god glory whiche viſible v ſheweth ſelfe v creature order hath ſtabliſhed worlde whiche hee maynteyneth ſtedfaſtly hee doeth nothing ſayde breake day ſpreadeth abroade lighteth vppon wing ſay vpon vttermoſt partes earth hebrue tongue woorde wing ſignifieth border vtmoſt partes thing yee ſee lighte caſteth ſelfe abroade ſpreadeth ouer worlde ſoone vvhen wee beholde darkeneſſe night wee woulde ſay muſte needes bee ſome greate battell chace ſame awaye howe ſo vvho coulde rid earth darkeneſſe ſo men might ſee euerywhere wheras earſte good ſhette vp dungeon vvho woulde thinke light ſhoulde ſo preuayle without ſome great terrible battel yet notwithſtanding morning doeth ſooner open eyelid ſheddeth forth light ouer vttermoſt partes earth anone sunne commeth take poſſeſsion dominion according god hath giuen ſoueraintie ouer day execute office hath committed vnto vve ſee entereth poſſeſsion ſo ſwiftly cāſcarcely cōceiue thought ſoone wee open eye sunne ſtryketh beames darkneſſe driuen quite away ſhall father vpon sun lifeleſſe creature impoſsible muſt go vvorkeman acknowledge maieſtie bee ſo excellent men ought humble thēſelues ſinke vnder giue neckes yoke honouring greatneſſe excellencie appeare god workes repine againſte whatſoeuer wee muſt nedes cōfoūded wit faile v thing viſible open v nedes muſt good right ſtoupe wayt full diſcouery laſt day cace concerneth incomprehenſible ſecretes let nowe ſuffize v conceiue thoſe thing faith cannot yet perceiue till wee haue learned ſhall good god hath bereft v mortall fleſh drawne v home himſelfe faſhioned v like himſelfe glory ſayd immediatly wicked ſhall ſhaken earth expoūd sunne ingendreth many diſeaſes therefore day breaketh yee woulde ſay clenſing worlde wicked men aſmuche ſome diſeaſe diſpatcheth agreeth wiſe matter firſte formoſt breake day doth rather releeue men foraſmuche time haue body moſt weeldie beſt diſpoſed yea euen poore ſoules ſicke haue beene turmoyled nyght ſomewhat cheered morning come inſomuche yee ſhall ſee well eaſed cauſe prophete malachie ſpeaking lorde ieſus chriſt calleth ſonne rightuouſneſſe wherein hee taketh ſimilitude dayſunne thing finde experience namely hee bryngeth v health hys wing ſay beames ſame clenzeth earth cheereth oure bodyes dumpiſhe humor according wee knowe night bringeth ſuche thing truely breaking day ingendred diſeaſes good men ſhoulde ſubiect well ill men therfore fitteſt expoſition wicked ſhall ſhaken earth ſay ſhall diſcerned ſpyed darkeneſſe continually men coulde diſcerne blacke white god hath ſo ſpreade light ouer worlde ſeene howe euerie man behaueth himſelfe true wicked ceaſſe misbehaue themſelues daye long haue feare god although bee aſhamed men yet fall licentiouſneſſe inſomuch ceaſſe play looce prankes euen high noone day yet perceiue ſome footeſteps ſpoken thing order worlde yet notwithſtanding god order appeareth ſeene ſo wee may ſay true god giueth satan head reſtreyneth wicked ſo much could giueth libertie triumph naughtines ſo thing broyle one ſide yet notwithſtāding preſeruation mankind god intēt ſending light repreſſe wicked thing wicked bridled ſecret prouidence god surely ſhoulde periſh euery turne yea rage would satan driuer thruſt headlong god wrought behalf vve know satan deadly ſo men deſireth nothing ſo much make cleane riddance creature wipe remembrance god worlde therfore needes muſt order come god trouble diſorder come men although wicked ſtill dwell vpon earth broade day light put theyr diſorders practiſe yet doeth god continually diſcouer meanes brydle them▪ ſo earth ſort clenzed riſing sunne meane vapour raigned night corruption gathered toogither ayre ſo thickned meene god purgeth clenzeth earth wicked foll •• ▪ abridgiug theyr lybertie bycauſe men poynte oute naughtipackes finger ſomwhat aſnamed ſay euen ſhameleſſe whiche haue ye woulde ſay ſealed vp owne eies haue notwithſtanding ſome inward remorſe ſo ſuffer themſelues ruſhe extremitie theyr lewdeneſſe thus yee ſee breake daye purgeth earth ſort howbeit altogither god maketh dayly purging addeth one effect sunlight whiche earth taketh newe ſhape thing whiche earth conteyneth ſerue garmente sunne ſhyneth manner nyght ſeaſon earth ſhapeleſſe man ſeeth nothing ye woulde ſay great quamire nothing bee diſcerned sunne beginneth riſe man taken pottes oute lumpe earth made well trimmed earth faſhioned withoute faſhion therefore god ſendeth light daye one hee faſhioned whole earthe giuing beautie ende ſhoulde beholde woondering ſo whereas naked ſhet vp barreyn afore leaſtwiſe reſpect eye clotheth againe heere cace concerneth men ſight earth night deſert waſte nothing ſeene vpon daytime clothed agayne bycauſe whiche waye ſoeuer wee turne eye ſee goodly deckings god hath put vpon according ſayth crowneth yeare bleſsing inſomuche hee repleniſheth earth frutes one hee put goodly garmentes crownes garlandes ſuche thing vpon vvhen ſee god worketh maner haue whereat bee aſtoniſhed yea cauſe confeſſe greateneſſe woorkes ſurmounteth wittes vtterly fayle although wee may parte taſte goodneſſe power wiſedome iuſtice yet notwithſtanding muſte fain length concluſion crie dauid lord wonderfull deepe thy workes bottomleſſe pit ſhall reherſe vnto thee true dauid reſtreyneth himſelfe recken vp god work babble without knowing ought god ſhewed ſayeth alſo may partly well iudge thing god ſheweth v whole creation worlde order hath ſtabliſhed therein ſhall ſee ſome footſteps iuſtice goodneſſe power wiſedome touched comprehending al thing perceiue vttermoſt point ſhall come farre ſhort muſt fayne cry woonderment lorde maruelous thy work lo haue marke effect vpon ſtreyne ſayde earth taketh new ſhape faſhion thing god hath ſet vpon garment wherwith decked whereas done day day yet common cuſtome inured v vnto ſurely would ſay wonderful thing vvherfore let v learne meaſure worthineſſe god workes dayly inioying ſo much ſtirred vp ſay worker whome muſt touche carpe doings rather ſubmitte ſelues humilitie god addeth immediatly wicked ſhall inioy light loftie arme ſhall broken ſerueth preuent queſtion might obiected howe might ſome man ſay seing god hath ordeyned sunne giue light world ſet thing ſo goodly order ſuffereth hee wicked inioy benefite hee ought haue ſette aſide owne child whiche ſerue honour ſhoulde ſeeme therefore hee doth amiſſe cace light sunne common good bad truely heerein ought conſider god goodneſſe better according alſo lorde ieſus chriſt telleth v follow heauenly father ſayth maketh sun ſhine euen vpon vnworthy therefore good enimies ſuch haue done harme ieſus chriſt would haue ſpoken ſo iuſte cauſe glorifie god inlightning whole world maner notwithſtanding moſte parte bee nought woorth wicked howbeeit ſtreyne yet ſomwhat ſhewed wit god calleth v ſort iudgement ſhould ſay true sunne doth tyme ſhine vpon wicked well vpon good one liueth well tarrie whyle wicked heyres worlde although receyue belongeth haue theyr eies open receiue light sunne yet ſhal vtterly bereft end therfore ſayeth theyr light ſhall taken vvhen ſayeth light hee ſheweth preſent tyme wee haue aduauntage outward appearance deſpiſers god heatheniſh ſort haue draw aire well haue light well wee eate drinke well ye ſee behoueth v beare paciently ſuche mingling nowe neuertheleſſe without cauſe god dooth heere lende lyght vntoo wicked make vnexcuſable yea verie deede ſuche light ſhal continue euer wheras part homage vnto god well life appurtenance therof ſhall heyres worlde child without cauſe doth paule fourth romanes cōuey ſame abraham faithfull therefore let v learne whenſoeuer sunne ſhineth ſame part inheritance foraſmuche god hath adopted v child sunne detter vnto v may recken parte goodes muche bee thought eating drinking oure inioying thing earth bringeth foorth due v god behalfe proceedeth meere liberalitie forſomuch hath chozen v childrē pure hart claime father earth oweth v nouriſhment al creature hand ſay may vſe freely ſame vſe ſhal continue v euer wee ſhall haue neede eate drinke gone world terming vſe bee continuall euerlaſting bleſſed bliſſefull oure preſente vſing god creature helpe ſaluation meanes god maketh v feele goodnes loue made partaker heauenly glorie worlde ſhall euer notwithſtanding ſhall haue neede meate drinke rayment yet ſhall haue better perfecter poſſeſsion wee haue daye without cauſe doth god adde heere light wicked haue claime themſelues ſhall taken may ſerue v declaration whiche touched afore namely wicked ſhall ſhaken breaking day ſay diſguiſe themſelues oure lorde doth reſtreyne although bee ſome diſorder yet men ſee ſome order intermedled whereby greate trouble aſſwaged whiche without ynoughto deſtroy whole worlde therefore nowadayes wee ſee wicked maye boaſt hauing light well wee yea woorſe haue full ſcope poore child god troden vnder foote troubled put open ſhame ſcarcely haue wherewith feede themſelues ſlenderly behooueth v beare paciently ende light ſhall bee taken wicked ſayde alſo loftie arme ſhall bee broken loftie arme god betokeneth power credit wicked haue worlde aſmuch hee giueth full ſcope exerciſing child behoof tamed world ſhould know beare god yoke therefore behooueth v paſſe trouble diſorders ſeene alſo trie faith paradiſe worlde hope vve coulde moued ſeeke ſpirituall life yea although wee miſerable may yet perceyue better ſtate deſired would thing woulde wiſhe requiſite god ſhould quicken v vp ſeeke kingdome cauſe giueth wicked full ſcope ſuffreth lift vp arme truely ſore trouble ſome temptation ſee wicked ſort lord maſters world wherof commeth bicauſe god hath reached hand minded magnifie faſhion vve ſee ſillie weakling ſhall troubled let v content ourſelues ſaid namely armes mighty ſhalbe cruſhed broken end thē oft ſee wicked beare ſway pride crueltie vaūt thēſelues credit let v reſort doctrine cōfort wit wheras haue armes vpō v ſeemeth ſhould break head god welynough brooſe breake aſunder therefore let v tary paciently till god performe hath ſpoken ſhall diſappointed ſo mindes quiet giue place prouidēce knoweth conuenient time working v appoynte thing furthermore wicked ought bethinke themſelues wel true doctrine ought ſerue chiefly comfort faythfull may vphilde mids aduerſities oppreſsions men trouble wrong let ſuche tymes call remembrance armes wicked muſte aduanced time vntill god breake yet notwithſtanding holy ghoſtement alſo threaten wicked bicauſe bee ſo outrageous beare themſelues hande able woorke woonders remoue mountaynes god ſayth v one worde tarie yee till armes nowe lifted vp bee broken muſte needes come paſſe vvill wee haue god bee enimie aduerſarie partie lette v lift vp armes ſay let v ſtretch scripture ſayeth committe outrage let v go aboute hurte harme neyghbours let euery v modeſtly conſider lawfull lette v ſo reſtreyne armes may ruled god woorde man preſume beyonde owne calling proceede maner god wil alwayes giue v new ſtrength although armes wearied yet ſtrēgthen againe end according alſo ſayeth doctrine goſpell muſt ſerue ſtrengthen v weake ſoeuer lyfteth vp arme alofte ſay whoſoeuer taketh vppon ought doo muſte ende haue armes broken god god enimie theſe greate taker vppon whiche mounte vp ſo hyghe pryde haue myldneſſe thus muche concerning poynte nowe ſayde diddeſt thou euer atteyne drop sea hebrue woorde god vſeth heere betokeneth teares commeth worde ſignifieth weepe ſhedde teares man tranſlate vnto greate deepes sea woorde alſo well agree waye behooueth v marke ſimilitude whiche god meeneth ſprings whiche greate deepes teares vvhence commeth infinit abundance water sea droppes whereof flowe water nowe ſayde abundance teares ſurely welſprings termed ye woulde ſay eye earthe looke eye doo ſhedde foorth teares man ſo doo fountaynes ooze oute moyſture earth god therefore ſtreyne vſeth ſimilitude ſayth come diddeſt thou euer go downe bottome sea ſearche drop yeeldeth forth ſay didſt thou euer enter depes ſee water ſewe know whence abundance cōmeth thou ſeeſt wherat thou art abaſhed better confirmation heere hee addeth haste thou ſeene gate death hast thou behilde gate ſhadowe death thing adde afterward concerning greate roomth largeneſſe earth intendeth ſhew effect wittes ſlender feeble cōprehende thing moſt apparant neere vnto v muſt need ſpite teeth confeſſe god ſheweth v ſuch wō ders ſerue rauiſhe v aboue vnderſtanding inforced confeſſe ſuch wiſedome god yea euen reſpect work open v ſheweth v finger ſhall doo thing hidden reſerueth himſelfe till laſt day ſuffereth appointeth many thing done world ſeeme ſtraunge ſecrete v wherin perceyue reaſon perchaunce ſome ſpirituall secretes vvhat ſay wee cannot comprehende thing heere feete wherevpon wee treade ſay wee faſten vppon ſhall wee ſaye thing aboue heauen whiche ſurmounte creature outreache common order nature lo effecte god meening nowe lette v learne wittes eger iudging thing lawfull v let v learne ſay thinke vpon sea vppon deepe place water ſay go wretched wight intendeſt thou doo ſayde god secretes ſo deepe gulfe man neuer come bottome thoſe gulfes doo farre exceede gulfes sea canſt thou drayne ryuer ſee whence water ſpring thou canſt ſo muche conceyue ſpring little fountayne whereoutof neuertheleſſe iſſueth greate brooke vvhen thou haſt bethought thee throughly thou canſt tell howe drayne riuer fountayne howe canſt thou enter gulfes ſea ſpie inchmeale whence abundance water commeth gathered togither nowe thou comprehendeſt materiall thing dareſt thou pleade againſt god ſo raſh ful preſumption reply againſt iudge go ſubdue vnto thee lo haue marke vpon ſtreyne true doctrine ſeemeth common among v man vnderſtandeth fare euer better ſee euery man taketh leaue libertie iudge fooliſhly god work bicauſe acquainted oure owne ſmalneſſe haue tyme learned god intendeth holde v awe ende wee ſhoulde preſume aught ſelues giueth v ſuch inſtructions bilowe vve nede mount aboue cloudes know incomprehenſible maieſty god let v caſt downe eye looke feete haue ſayd afore ſhall confounded hand ſhould poſsible v enter ſecret purpoſe god know al thing ſo nothing might eſcape v nature rather go downwarde mount vpward vvho hath giuen v wing ſtie ſo high nay ſo lū piſh fall alwaies ground yet notwithſtanding looke euen vpon thing heere beneath beholde bottomleſſe pittes ſwallow v vp howe ſhall wee mount vp heauen ſearche thing god hath ſhet vp muſte needes marueilous ouerweening ſuch one cōmeth forgetfulneſſe one drop ſettled witte ſurely would rather learne modeſt yee ſee doctrine ſuperfluous leaſtwiſe men woulde put well vre concluſion let v learne god hath granted v ſingular benefite forſomuch weakneſſe rawneſſe vnderſtanding hee hath gyuen v farre better thing ſight bottomleſſe deepes vvhy ſo lookingglaſſe goſpel maketh v behold ſecretes heauen ſo farre foorth expedient v yea ſay ſo farre neceſſary v v follow owne fooliſh inordinate luſtes muſt cōtent ſelues god openeth vnto v curious ſearching beyond word let contente v hee inlighteneth v holy ſpirite ende wee may iudge woorkes becommeth v ſo ſhall thing fulfilled whiche moyſes ſayeth namely say ſhall go downe deepes vvho ſhall climbe vp aboue clowdes vvho ſhall go ouer sea beholde woorde god thy mouthe thine heart content thy ſelfe ſeeing god granteth v prerogatiue teaching v thing ſchoole hee knoweth profite good made v paſſe ouer ſea go deepes climbe aboue clowdes ſhort come boſome vvhat deſire let v bee contented knowledge whiche hee gyueth v nowe woorde learning goſpell wayting till hee diſcouer fully largely vnto v ſhall come paſſe hee maketh v ſee thing face face ſee part nowe lette v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may thinke better vpō wantes corruption nature wee haue done end diſtruſting ourſelues vtterly wittes end may run vnto deſire thing ſo gouerne v wee may bee clenzed vice ſo reformed image ſinfulneſſe nature may beaten downe killed ende feeling power hath wrought ſo v may glory nothing meere goodneſſe may pleaſe graūt grace v alſo al people nation earth bringing backe al poore ignorant ſoules frō miſerable bondage errour darkneſſe right c cl sermon fourth vpon xxxviij chapter 18 haſt thou conſidered large place earth tell thou knovve 19 vvhich vvay vvhere lyght dvvelleth vvhere place darkeneſſe 20 thou maiſt receiue boundes vnderſtande pathes houſe 21 haſt thou knovvne thou vvert borne though thy dayes many number 22 haſt thou entred treaſures ſnovve haſt thou ſeene treaſures haile 23 vvhich haue layde vp tyme aduerſitie day vvarre battel 24 vvhat vvay light parted eaſt vvinde ſcattered vpon earth 25 vvho hee hath deuided courſe rayne vvaye lyghtning thunder 26 make rayne vpon land vvhere perſon vpon vvilderneſſe vvhere mā 27 fill vvild vvaſt place make budde herbes come foorth 28 vvho father rayne vvho hath begotten droppes deavve 29 vvhoſe belly came yce vvho hath ingendred froſt heauen 30 vvaters hidden ſtone face deepe frozen 31 canſt thou reſtreine pleaſantneſſe pleyades vntie bandes orion 32 canſt thou make mazzaroth come forth time canſt thou guyde arcturus vvith sonnes although matter reherſed heere ſeeme bee none ſuch commōly knowne already yet wee looke well thing euery man deeme needeful ouerweening ſhould repreſſed woord twayne long declaracions ſuch god maketh although haue graūted wit weake comprehend god work yet notwithſtanding needeth turning hand leade v ſome fooliſh curioſitie preſumption foolehardineſſe caryeth v away headlong like madneſſe therefore let v thinke ſtraunge lorde vſeth ſo long talke make v perceiue v iudge work ynough wee know part according rudeneſſe giue v ſome taſte meane wherby ſhall profite beare away thing ſhall bee ſpoken thereof let v looke vpon ſayd heere mention made earth god demaundeth whither man able meaſure dubble meaſuring earthe one knowe largeneſſe worlde inhabited may ſort comprehended coniecture alſo whole earth ſelf comprehending ſame parte ſo couered ſea ſeene impoſsible iudge greatneſſe put cace men could determine euery whit yet notwithſtanding men knowne ſuch miracle ought bee abaſſhed glorifie maker without cauſe god demaundeth whither able neuertheleſſe impoſsible ſayd afore ſcarſly haue men ſubſtantiall proofes whereby know length bredth world inhabited man ſpeake whole maſſe bodie earth impoſsible bring paſſe largeneſſe therof ſhould bee knowne wit man atteyneth thervnto thing go incloſe maieſtie ſecret purpoſe god within vnderſtanding ſayd god holdeth earth hild three fowre graynes duſt hand neede open hand keepe hand ſhet yet hold duſt ſtill within god vſeth ſame ſimilitude prophet eſay ſhewe wee ſpeake think muſt meaſure thing ſeene earth infinite reſpect v yet notwithſtanding hold cloce fiſt wit proportionable reſpect betwixt incomprehenſible ineſtimable glory whole maſſe earth great earth nothing compariſon thoſe yee ſee thing whiche haue marke ſtreyne conſider earth ſo greate largeneſſe outreacheth vnderſtanding behoueth v well aſſured holdeth able hold fiſt hath another maner greatneſſe himſelf therefore v confeſſe owne feebleneſle wee bee rude groſſewitted herevpon let v honour acknowledge doings ſuch perfection fault found v replie againſt bicauſe ignorant thus ye ſee haue effect gather vpon ſayd ſpeaking way light afterwarde thunder lightning according mention made afore without cauſe matter repeated wee ſawe yeſterday ſoone breake day appereth▪ whole world lightned throughout wing earth ſay vttermoſt partes diſcouered ſo earth taketh newe ſhape al done one inſtant time seyng ſuch miracle appeareth eye reaſon god ſhould bee gloryfied thereby wee needes play iolie felowes deſerue puniſhed ouerweening laughed ſcorne god hand fooliſh luſt haue comprehend thing high v path ſhould light go v appoynt would appoynt way farre wyde ſhould ſpreade poſsible v go beyonde whole maſſe earth • nd attayne vttermoſt part worlde vvhat furious madneſſe v preſume iudge god wonderfull workes sith cannot conceyue howe commeth paſſe light ſo ſoone ſpredde abroade hath taken poſſeſsion name sunne reigne ouer day let v learne exalt god ſuch wiſe creature greatneſſe highneſſe workes wee oure ſide acknowledging owne ſlenderneſſe may brideled humble ſelues way men honour god accordingly mean 〈…〉 glorie themſelues take thing vppon aboue magnifie god neuer ſo muche meane whyle needes bee companion purpoſe vvee cannot doo god greater wrong compare ſelues deſire abace vnto v ſay hee ſhoulde bee mate fellowe god ſhall neuer bee duely honoured v excepte wee bee firſte brought nothing wee acknowledge nothing v wretchedneſſe lo wee haue beare minde mention made heere way whiche hilde light eyther ſetteth ryſeth worlde ſayde afterwarde man knoweth treaſures snow hayle god vſeth ſame ſimilitude treaſures ſpeaketh chaſtizements whiche hee ſendeth vpon men ſayth hath terrible ſortes layde vp treaſures man knoweth ſimilitude importeth twoo thing one greate ſtore man ſay dozen frenchecrownes treaſure muſt bee greate maſſe quantitie treaſure hidden layde vp therfore whē god ſpeaketh treaſures ſnow hayle meaneth ſtore ſo far paſsing vnderſtanding man wee muſte needes bee aſtoniſhed thinke vppon therewithall betokeneth alſo cauſe thereof hidden v vvee ſee snowe hayle wellynough doo wee perceyue thing making hayle ſnowe doo wee knowe howe commeth paſſe true philoſophers well diſpute men ſhall ſee ſome cauſes alledged yet verie ſmall inſight wonderfull order god hath ſet nature hee hath ſecrete priuitie himſelfe whiche reache capacitie ſo wee come ſhort nowe wee perceyue wherefore god ſpeaketh maner treaſures hayle snowe remayneth put ſame doctrine practiſe vvhiche v able make one handefull snowe arte cunning vvho turne water vapour hayle hoarefroſt let men beate braynes aboute much liſt yet neuer able compaſſe vve cannot make one heare head white black ſith ſo haue cauſe magnifie ineſtimable power god couereth whole earth ſnow vvhence taketh hee ſo greate quantitie water truly men ſay ingendered middle roomth ayre colde great quantitie vapour bee drawne vp thither length ſame cōmeth togither freezeth thereof ingendreth ſnow ſame ſtuffe harder bound thē hayle ingendred bicauſe thing become faſte ſubſtanciall men may well ſay ſo true yet ſtraūge thing ſo ſhort time ſo great ſtore ſhould vtter ſelfe whiche bene hidden afore sometimes weather ſhall fayre winter within two three dayes ſnow ſhall fall twoo three foote deepe vpon ground pray ought ſuch change make heares ſtand vp ſtiffe vpō heades leaſtwiſe dull ende leade v ſome feare god furthermore wee bee rightly minded ought moued beare ſuch reuerēce god acknowledge power ſo high aboue v yea euen viſible earthly thing giueth v cauſe glorifie cōfeſsing ignorance yee ſee haue gather vppon worde treaſure well applying thereof owne vſe beſides let v call minde ſayd ſong moyſes god hath chaſtizements layd vp treaſuries comprehende ende ſteppe ſquare wee ſee men oftentimes worke ſpite agaynſt god bearing thē ſelues hand ſcaped god hand hee haue deliuered incōuenience ſeemeth worſt paſt ſo doo ſhake eares prouerbe ſayth let v call minde god telleth v know ye ſayth roddes layd vp treaſures ſhould ſay whē ſhall haue beaten one faſhion afterwarde haue pitied thinke ſelues quit haue meanes cannot cōceiue vvhen wee haue bene chaſtized one maner doozen ſcourges mo whiche neuer thought therefore ſtand ye feare preuent mine anger tempt hereafter leaſt vtter ſcourges vpon cauſe ſayde god keepeth treaſures time aduerſitie day incounter battell would ſay artillerie ſpeares ſwords wherewith fight agaynſt enimies doubte god vſing ſimilitude incounter battell ment betoken wee haue warre fenced furniſhed alreadie ſuche ſorte wee muſte needes go worſe wee haue ſtrength power ſtande agaynſt hande▪ vvee may well put armour aſſemble ayde world v ſcape hande ſhall haue ſet al creature battell maner againſt v commaunded gyue charge vppon v therefore lette v learne firſte godneedeth borowe helpe would auendged enemy ynough determine owne purpoſe ſpeake woorde ſhewe immediatly heauen earth bring army number ſith hee couereth earth foote twayne thicke ſnowe hee able ouerwhelme v liſteth thinke wee power abated hee cannot ſende ſnowe thirtie pole deepe aboue head againe ſometimes wee ſee earth frozen winde dothe ſo binde becommeth harde yron letteth god ſhoulde leaue alwayes ſame plight lette v marke god needeth make great preparation incounter enemy put foyle let onely ſay woorde whole world ſhal fire creature ſhall ſerue deſtroy men sith heare lette v learne ſtoupe vnder mightie hand god make warre ſo mighty lord ſhall gayne let v learne obey eyther muſt vphild hand elſe muſt haue againſt v meane betweene thē true god beare v time according ſayd wayteth menne couert yet muſt needes vnder protection elſe haue enemie ſo appeare ende therefore lette v yeelde ſelues vnto may preſerue v wee continue vnder gouernance keeper welfare lette v aſſure ſelues wee ſafe agaynſt bothe hayle ſtormes tempeſtes hayle ingendered ſelfe nother doth ſnowe fall without commaundement bothe treaſures vvhen man liſteth lay forth thing keepeth locked vp euen ſo creature god ſendeth foorth pleaſure therefore neede feare haile ſtormes ſo long god keeping contrarywize muſt needes diſquieted vexed continually god agaynſt v herewithall let v marke howe ſayde reſerueth day battell day aduerſitie ſhould ſay men neede vaunt themſelues wont god ſcourgeth proſperitie doth ſo rocke v aſleepe bethink v fault nother enter account ſelues know cace godward long wee haue reſpit like euill paymayſters vnthrifts waſt away paſſeth owing hundred crownes ſo long called vpon day payment come maketh good cheere ſo long hath one pennie purſe euen ſo play wee god giue v reſpite wee nothing elſe ruffle thinke nomore vpon therefore according whiche ſhewed v god ſende nother hayle thunder skare v one way heauen wee muſte therevpon runne aſtray fall aſleepe ſpie fitte time chaſtize v lette v preuent tarie till day battell come trumpet ſounde alarme battell ioyned late ſay let v fall compoſitiō let v deuize ſome meanes agreement yea yea tyme paſt vvherefore whyle god forbeareth v giueth v leyzure bethinke ſelues ſo wee haue time truce looke v enter iudgement ourſelues let v preuent rigour become owne iudges end iudged let v cōdemne ſelues intent wee may bee quit infinite grace goodneſſe thus ye ſee haue marke vpō ſtreyne mētion made god reſeruing thing day battell namely ſerueth ſhew wee haue warre come giuing onſette like warre proclaymed betwene two prince enemy many bickering go abrode booty forage cōmeth pitched field knowne hath wōne loſt euen ſo v diſpleaſe god plucke ſelues hand become ſtubborne againſt open warre proclaymed ſide vve defie god mouth nother ſend herault defie yet foraſmuch ſinnes proceede furious rage proclayming warre agaynſt ſeing enemie tarie neuertheleſſe battell giuen firſt day god letteth v alone ſo wee ſtand vp ſtill time let v looke come ioyning hand ſtrokes length howbeit looking let v linger ſay lette v bethinke v long whyle afore hand let v welter ſinnes wicked deedes leaſt wee kindle fire wrath caſting wood make conſume v vpon knowledge hereof let v take aduauntage tyme craue pardon hand beholde wee haue marke yet true god doth oftentimes puniſhe rightuous well vnrightuous hayle tempeſts affliction common bothe part contrarywiſe maketh sunne ſhyne vpon good bad yet behoueth v bee alwayes perſuaded scripture telleth v god ſcourges whereby intendeth correct ſinnes ſending v hayle tempeſtes ſuche like thing yet notwithſtandyng rightuous haue whereof reioyce know god chaſtizing fatherly good ende ſhould periſh paule ſayeth temporall chaſtizements ought put v minde ſins according record god diſpleaſure neuertheleſſe walke feare put truſt alwayes pitie v handle v mercie rigour although correct v yet ſhall profit welfare god thē ſheweth well outward ſignes maketh warre agaynſt thoſe ſerue walke feare yet ſoeuer befall redoūdeth welfare bycauſe abateth rigour towards maketh temporall chaſtizements ſerue thē medicine ſalues notwithſtanding generally correction put v minde ſinnes▪ therewithall ſhewe v warre god deſerue haue fight agaynſt v arme creature deſtruction lo effect wee ought practize texte nowe conſequently ſayde god rayne vpon wilderneſſe noman dwelleth earth ſhall ſo moyſtened ſhall yeeld frute vvherin matter ſtill cō tinued namely god worketh ſuch ſorte euen common order nature wee bee abaſhed wittes bee dazeled doubt wee ſhall ſee doings yea conceyue ſome reaſon yet wee haue caſt cardes throughly wee ſhall alwayes bee driuen conclude god wiſedome hidden v meene euen theſe manifeſt thing cauſe aboue v wherevnto wee bee able reach therefore behoueth v alwayes come backe poynt comprehende throughly conteyned vvee ſee rayne fall wee know effect ingendered vapour wee ſee rayne cauſeth earth budde yea wilderneſſes dwell inhabiters wexe greene alſo wee ſee thing wonder iuſtly trouble man curſtly water garden trauell labour bring nothing except god giue influence heauen watering worlde good vnleſſe ſome rayne dewe fall heauen one theſe hath workfulneſſe water brought mannes deuyce therefore wee ſee deſertes growe greene therein god intendeth ſhewe aſſured token effectualneſſe rayne whiche ſendeth little gardines men continually watering afterwarde commeth rayne dewe ſo thing growe euen apparantly ſight looke vpon waſte grounde whiche burnt vp day noman watereth ſoyle drie ſelfe yet notwithſtanding god maketh bryng forth abundance hearbes graſſe meanes rayne sith wee ſee ſuch thing familiarly god ſheweth himſelfe v iuſter cauſe haue wee glorifie cānot meanes excuſe ſelues vnthankfulneſſe greate matter ſee god miracle eye yea poynteth v fingar thing ſeene onely man life beginneth newe agayne day day yet notwithſtanding wee thinke rightly vpon vvee tread vpon graſſe feete yet vouchſafe caſte eye thither ſay bliſſed god maketh earth beare frute ſorte furthermore let v therewithall bethinke v owne rudeneſſe dulneſſe cannot tell one braunche hearb ſpringeth forth ſee mine eye cauſe ſo hidden wittes end ſee whē grayne corne rotteth earth ſpringeth agayne bringeth forth number graynes nurriſhment men ſee theſe thing miracle god yet cōsider ought surely man woulde thinke firſt bluſhe leſſon ſuperfluous needeleſſe thing treate growing corne graſſe doth euery man ſee it▪ wee well ynough acquaynted yes truely yet yeeldeth god due honour deface glory maieſtie aſmuch therefore knowledge wee weene haue ſhall make v guiltie bicauſe vnthankfulneſſe wrayeth ſelf therein howſoeuer world go let v alwaies beare minde euen baſeſt thing incomprehenſible wiſdome god vve perchaunce ſay knowne great ſmall come ſouerayne cauſe bee found euen wizeſt v ſeeke behalfe would ſhew fineneſſe wit god auendged pryde according alſo good reaſon ſhoulde make v perceyue wonderfull woorkes haue knowledge ſame parte thereafter pleaſeth deale vnto v hath bene ſayd alwayes reſerueth ſtil ſome part himſelf ſomuch keepeth cauſes thing hidden ſecrete owne minde whereinto v preſume enter goodly leſſon know put difference maner betweene thing god reueleth vnto v thing keepeth himſelfe according alſo moyſes ſpeaketh thereof god ſayeth keepeth ſecrets himſelfe thing reueled belong v child according cōteyned law true moyſes ſpeaketh lawe publiſhed ſayde let v bethinke ſelues god hath graunted v ſingular benefite vouchſafing ſhewe v gyuing v peculiar inſtruction howe walke commaundements therefore let v receyue record let v ſuffer god ſchole v let v good ſcholers meane whyle let v let alone ſecretes ſay lette v hold v contented doctrine hath ſet downe vnto v let bee meeteyard lette v paſſe vvhy ſo lordes ſecretes ſayeth belong himſelf thing reueleth belong vnto v way wee may apply text ſette downe vvhy ſo▪ ſee god ſheweth v order nature howbeit ſmall porcion intendeth holde v alwayes ſhorte▪ ſhewe v wee bee dull ſimplewitted mount ſo high know god ſecrets let v learne take inſtructiō god giueth v profit ſelues let v go neceſſarie admonition conſidering one ſide rechleſneſſe otherſide fond preſumptuouſneſſe men god hyde ſecretes v ſhould ſeeme would go know whither apparant howe deſirous eager menne knowe thing reueled vnto ſay would fayne know woulde fayne knowe that▪ therewithall ſtreyne themſelues enter diſcourſe thing thing concealed holy scripture lo menne haue alwayes ouer labored thēſelues knowe thing god ment teache bycauſe knoweth good vvee ſee madde preſumptuouſneſſe men deſirous conceyue brayne thing graunted enter god ſecretes whither againe otherſide retchleſſe take holde thing god teacheth v god declareth v ſo farforth behoof chaweth meate v intēt might ſwallow downe eaſlier bicauſe knoweth v weakling teacheth v familiarly according owne nature verely holy ſcripture plain diſcouerie thing be▪ good god appeereth outright wee applied mindes therevnto ſhould finde thing whiche requiſite welfare god applieth himſelfe rudeneſſe hee talketh familiarly v yea liſpeth ſorte nurce would hir little babe yet wee carefull profite ſelues folowing therefore ſeing wee ſo rechleſſe negligent profite holy ſcripture yet meane ſo curious inquiſitiue rather ſo fooliſh madbraynd couet know thā meete v let v beare mind moyſes telleth v lord ſecrets belōg himſelf therfore muſt inquiſitiue thing whiche god liſted diſcloze vnto v contented taught meane hath ordeyned meane whyle let god alone ſecrets without aſſaying reach aboue glorifie knowing yet come perfection beholding face face behoueth v firſt trāsformed image thing ſhall fully done till haue ridde v cleane fleſhly imperfection let v remember effect haue taſted god wiſdome iuſtice goodneſſe creature wee muſte conclude come higheſt degree fayle thereof middes way thereby let v take warning honour ſubmit ſelues wholly nowe mention hath bene made earth deepes▪ water ſnow rayne moyſteneth ſuche thing ſpeaking skie ſtarres lorde ſetteth downe thing haue ſeene whiche order sky man ſhall perceyue many recordes goodneſſe loue towardes v alſo many ſignes wrath pleaſeth viſite v ſinnes make v feele iudge cauſe ſayd purpoſely come wa • thou borne created planet starres • nd ſignes heauen wa • thou arte thou able bid go may go canst thou restreyne pleaſantneſſe pleyades canst thou vntie vnknitte loozen handes • ion certayne celeſtiall ſignes named wherin hebrues ſelues agree yet notwithſtanding man may perceyue firſt worde ſet downe betokeneth certayne ſtarres appeere ſpringtime bring ſweete rayne open earth make yeelde frute cauſe ſayde canst thou bynde vp reſtreyne pleaſantneſſe pleyades whiche cauſe earthe become freſh greene canſt thou reſtreyne god ſending men pleaſant ſpring time glad withall afterwarde hee ſpeaketh orion cleane contrarie ſigne bringeth great bluſtring ſtormes waterfloudes otherſome tranſlate arcturus whiche termed keeper thing ſhet vp reſtreyned vapour haled vp ayre needefull ſtande muche vpon point ynough v know ſigne betokeneth great tempeſts rage water therefore ſayde art thou able vntie band would ſay wee beare ſway sky ſo muche wee rauiſhed wittes thinke vpon nowe firſt let v marke texte men warned ſhortneſſe life ſerueth repreſſe would ouerſhoote ſelues farre thinke ſelues much ado haue borne yet wee needes blame god doings yea ſhall teach leſſon though hee skill gouerne worlde time thing created counſell god helpe thing put ſo goodly wonderfull order nothing v ſo much wee could hardly get mother wombe yet notwithſtanding▪ wee take vpon v iudges fayre ſight yong babe coulde ſcarce ſpeake ſhoulde take vpon gouerne whole world chalendge wiſdome diſcretion bee ſelfe alone wee compariſon god although come foureſcore hundred yeares age reſpecte euerlaſting time wiſdome god worlde created againe reſpecte gouernement hath continued ſo long time therefore ſo euer wee thinke vpon ſhortneſſe life let v bee ſure meanes god rebateth pryde intent wee ſhould ſo ſelfewyze take vpon v diſpute againſte firſte cheefe leſſon wee haue learne god ſchoole verie well doubt wee ſhall haue whereof make boaſt ſhall haue profited poynt therefore ſo long wee bee conuerſant worlde let v bee contented heare god ſpeake beare mynde ſo euer hee telleth v wee may profite moreouer let v goe aduaunce ſelues againſt onely ſaying life nothing ynough holde v awe meeldneſſe lo wee haue beare away one ſide heerewithall haue alſo good comfort gather ſo much wee ſee god hath preſerued world ſo long time good ſtate wee borne wee neede doubt prouide time come therefore whenſoeuer vexed troubled great thought minde therby prouoked let v put ſelues god hande knoweth howe gouerne hee yong beginner ſith wee ſee order hathe continued euer ſince creation worlde chaunges haue happened meane whyle men perceyue thing haue bene ſo well diſpozed world hath ſtill bene preſerued right ſtate ſay wee bethinke v well thereof haue cauſe glorifie god ſeing iuſtice goodneſſe wiſedome power appeere therein let v contented therewith aſſure ſelues hee aſwell continue ſame ende hee hath begonne lo haue marke agayne whereas mention made commaunding celeſtiall ſignes let v alwayes marke impoſsible orderlineſſe wee ſee ſhould come eyther ſtarres themſelues mouing hande god gouerneth aboue ſo although ſtarres haue ſeaſons mount aboue v likewiſe go againe ſight yet notwithſtanding lette v aſſure ſelues ſame happeneth auenture god commaundeth although hee haue giuen influence heauen yet hath guyding ouerruling ſtill proofe hereof planet moue yeeres alike yet apparant greate oddes mouing vvhat cauſe earth freſhe ſpringtime bycauſe pleyades reygne howbeeit god reygneth ouer although hee haue giuen celeſtiall ſignes influence yet doe thing owne peculiar motion thing vve ſhould ſee ſpring time cōtinue one euen meaſurable rate ſay ſhould neuer nother ouermuch heate ouermuch cold ſhould neuerfal one droppe rayne one yeere another ſhould neuer bee alteration ſith ſuche diuerſitie wee ſee yeeres farre vnlike one another thereby wee perceyue nother rayne ſnowe ingender owne power god althoughe hee haue giuen ſome property ſtarres reſerueth ſtill ruling himſelfe declareth hee hath ſouerayne gouernment diſpoſeth thing knoweth expedient muche behoueth v marke theſe text wherin god telleth v although ſtars haue naturall courſes property yet notwithſtanding driuen owne power nother giue influence world▪ otherwiſe god commaundeth ſo obey ſouereygne dominion hee hath ouer creature therefore let v learne gaze ſtarres thoughe power ſelues either good harme let v pray vnto good god pleaſeth make creature ſerue vſe alſo graunt v grace ſo profite thereby onely may bee glorified moreouer wee ſee thunder lightning tempeſts ſtormes let v aſſure ſelues ſeing commaundement maketh ſerue pleaſure ſhall ſafe protection ſhall haue inward witneſſe hee hath receyued v mercie taketh v child furthermore ſo euer wee thinke vpon god work let ſuch ſoberneſſe modeſtie may learne inquiſitiue god maieſtie holde ſelues contented bee taught according meaſure capacitie withal openeth thing v ordinarie meanes worde let v open eye conſider wee ought yeelde eares herken telleth v ſo may rechleſſe behalf thing high profoūd v let v let alone wayt day ful diſcouerie wherevnto good god calleth v ſhall ſuch time tranſformed glorie nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement faultes praying make v feele better wee haue done generally alſo bewray wantes intent deface v vtterly make v ſeke whole welfare therewithall apply v ſeruice hee may bee exalted among v ſo wee oure ſide may acknowledge god ſide acknowledge v people ſo let v ſay almightie god heauenly father acknowledge confeſſe according truth c clj sermon fifth vpon xxxviij chapter firſt vpon xxxix chapter 33 knovveſt thou vvay heauen canſt thou ſet rule thereof vpon earth 34 canſt thou crie aloude cloudes aboundance vvater may couer thee 35 canſt thou ſende lightening canſt thou make vvalke vvill ſay vnto thee lo heere vve 36 vvho hath put vviſdome heart giuen vnderſtanding 37 vvho vviſdome appoint heauen vvhat ſhould doe vvho ſtay barrel heauen 38 vvhen duſt cloddeth earth hardneth xxxix chapter vvilte thou hunte praye lyon giue lyon vvhelpe vvherevvith ſatiſfie 2 vvhen dennes vvhen lie lurking corner 3 vvho prepareth meate rauens vvhen yong one crie vnto god vvander vvithout meate 4 knovveſt thou time vvhen vvilde goates yeane knovveſt thou caluing time hyndes 5 canſt thou tell time going vvith calfe vvhen ſhould calue 6 bovve ſelues make yong one parte caſte ovvne ſorovves 7 yong one vvex fat grovve vvith corne go returne againe heere ſame matter purſued ſtill hathe beene treated theſe former dayes whiche men comprehende whole order nature rather conuicted owne vnskilfulneſſe ought take warning humble ſelues god admitte doings good well done therefore ſayde men knowe way heauen ſay wote order ſhould bee kept yet notwithſtanding much ſee god hath done ought bee amazed ſo great wiſdome ſhewed put building heauen ſide would wee beginne nay making bodie ſome one starre planet could wee bring paſſe nowe great number starres therwithall great diuerſitie moreouer great diſtinction diſtance betwixt yea planet placed ſuch order moone neereſt vnto v sunne far aboue planet yet far aboue suune starres skie hold higheſt roome conſidering ſuche varietie heauen v able compaſſe vnderſtanding ſo might parcelmeale ſet forth al courſes order ſuch wiſe ſee therfore without cauſe doth ſcripture ſay star ye would ſay hoſts army heauen god hath furniture ought aſtoniſh v sith ſo let v learne honor god muche ſheweth ſo infinit wiſdome thing ſee sky let v acknowledge hath wrought aboue capacitie yea euen ſuche wiſe great wiſdome v thing ſeene eye ſay know reaſon refer right end nowe followeth bicauſe haue thing eſtimation therfore able ourſelues looke vpon ſingular peece worke wee ſhall bee conſtreyned commend made meane euen among mortall men yet doth therefore follow well contrary wiſe ſame welliking record vnderſtand nothing compariſon let v come vnto god ynough v commend perſon hath made excellent peece woorke ought rauiſhed doings seing ſo let v come backe poynt namely ſubmit oure ſelues wholly vnto attempt thing aboue abilitie bee haſtie iudging haue bene wont ſayde immediatly hee ſhall restreyne ſtay barrelles heauen cloudes ſo terrned text alſo pſalme make v vnderſtand god wonderfull power holding backe water againſt nature wee knowe water ſheadeth ſinketh downeward bycauſe heauie nature yet water hanging ayre ſtay neuertheleſſe wherof commeth ſtaying bycauſe god holdeth faſt ſhet vp barrelles tonne tub hebrue worde ſet downe place betokeneth properly tubbe water potte yee ſee cloudes god veſſelles bee made wood earth without thing holde god onely commaunding water keepe ſelues ſuffyzeth make ſtay withall ſhewed v alſo ſtandeth v greatly hand god ſhuld ſo ſhet vp heauen might rayne continually thing earth ſhould always one clodde men could ſowe likewiſe contrarie parte ſhould come rayne earth woulde bee hard ſo coulde yeelde frute would become like yron ſo men could get nothing nowe needefull god ſhould make rayne conuenient ſeazon hee alſo ſhoulde reſerue ſome time fayre weather vvee ſee wee thinke thing worthie admiration muſt wee bee ouerfrowarde glorifie god confeſsing belongeth order thing according belongeth vnto v accepte doings good rightfull euen acknowledging weakeneſſe owne wittes whoſoeuer preſumeth murmure againſt god maketh ſelfe wyzer hee euen deſpite wee yeelde god deſerued prayſe acknowledging owne ignoraunce wee take good heede iudge workes ſo ſee wherevnto wordes tende alledged alſo ſayde expreſly v ſende foorth lightening planetes ſtormes haue ſuch wiſe oure commaundement ſhoulde ſay lo heere wee hee vve may well commaund sunne moone wee cauſe make euer haſte wee eyther hinder courſe whit seeing wee perceyue one commaundement god gaue creating world ſaid haue sunne reygne ouer daye moone ouer nyght ſhall bee diuerſitie ſeaſons springtime sommer vvinter ſo forth ſay sith wee ſee one commaundement heauen mainteyneth courſe keepeth perfect order ought wee confeſſe belongeth god gouerne thing wee take doings good woorth diueliſh pryde v ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed therefore lette v wey well ſpeech ſayde wet ſende foorth planet thunder lightening true ioſua ſtay courſe sunne ſaying sunne ſtande thou ſtill thy place go forewarde owne power nay rather god ſhewed mouth mortall man howe mightie effectuall worde ioſuaze wordes ſounde vaniſhed away ayre muche hee ſpake authoritie god attempted thing vpon owne heade sunne could obey sunne obeyed mortall mannes voyce bycauſe commaundement god muche mightie thing god hathe owne maieſtie glory euerlaſting ſpoken ſettled courſe sun moone order heauen therefore marke well theſe wordes oure owne profite make v exalt god hee worthie ſubmitte ſelues wholy vnto hold al conceit thought captiue ende wee take vpon v lawfull v ſurely purpoſe v ſtart bound againſt ſayde heere planet 〈…〉 ſay heere ought 〈…〉 commaundement vvhen men need take vpon meete neades worke ſpite againſt yea leape ſo farre oute ſquare blaſpheme chaunge thing order nature make sunne ayre parte worlde ſtande awe creature moue god therefore doth mocke follie pryde ſpeaking maner contrarie parte wee ſee sunne moone starres ſay vnto lo without ſpeaking whatſoeuer god appoynteth haue nother witte vnderſtanding yet led ſecret inclination execute god ſo euer bade creation worlde sith wee ſee ought wee reuerence maieſtie euen ſenſleſſe creature obey ye ſee wee haue gather vpon ſaying nowe foloweth conſequently v hunt praye lyon feede lyon whelpes fill giue rauens whereon feede nouriſhe yong one crie vnto god vve knowe manner feeding lyon wilde beaſtes craue two three morſelles ſatiſfie require much ſuſtenance bycauſe beaſtes deuour ſwallowe vp muche nowe finde prouiſion true prince may well keepe ſome lyon pleaſure ſome wylde beaſtes prince able finde foode ſuſtenaunce lyon worlde nowe nothing elſe wylde beaſts ſee haue wherewith ſuſteyne ſpecially god prouiſion ſufficient miracle ſtirre v vp acknowledge goodneſſe god wee ſhall ſee god meening texte yet better wee haue eye ſelues vvhat letteth lion wylde beaſtes deuour men world happeneth wee pray god ſhould let looce lion beares elephant al wild beaſtes many number diuers kind pray ſhould deſtroyed hand cauſe thē lion ſatiſfied notwithſtanding haue need great nouriſhment therwithall worlde preſerued continued ſtate god prouideth remedie matter according alſo ſayde light sunne driueth away wild beaſts maketh get thē dēnes men may haue libertie go buſineſſe god ſhould ſhet vp wilde beaſts maner giue men earth traffike labour vpon thing shoulde wee haue one corner hide heades yee ſee thing ment text god gaue lion foode men ſhould quyte cleane ridde earth ſhould go hauocke deſtruction god working manner compelleth v commend gracious goodneſſe pitieth v holdeth v vnder protection ſo wee periſh wee muſt needes haue done fatherly care preſerue v true ſometimes lyon may well deuour men happeneth cheefly deſerte country hote landes greate ſtore wylde beaſtes commeth ſo paſſe god warneth v thereby ſame miſcheefe ſhould vniuerſall prouided otherwiſe ſee wilde beaſts deuour men ſorte therein wee haue fayre lookingglaſſes vvhereof long followe forewarde raunge vnto men houſes conſume muſte ſetting ſtop way needes god hand man pollicie preuenteth let v magnify god vouchſafing feede wilde beaſtes ſuch wiſe liue worlde inioy benefit hath beſtowed vpon v furthermore vpon reading text let v remember alſo ſayd foure thirtith pſalme althoughe lyon bee ſo ſtrong ſeeke praye ſuch violence yet ſuffer hunger although paſſe mannes power ſatiſfie ſuffer hunger yet god alwayes nouriſh thoſe compariſon well worthie bee marked god feede lyon whiche wilde terrible beaſtes yea irkeſome nature ſhall feede men created owne image termeth child specially ought doubt nouriſh whē call vpon father true fayth holie ſpirite reigneth heart thinke god forſake v wee flee vnto refuge ſeing feedeth wilde beaſts giueth foode rauens ſhall ſayde anon ſee ſerueth v double vſe one muſt hold god wonderful goodneſſe prouideth food lion al beaſts ſo preſerued midſt thē god feede lion wilde beaſtes much likely carefull feed v bicauſe child ſeing cōmaundeth v come vnto ſeke wil deal v ordinarie bread feed v bicauſe haue thing hee giueth v effect thing haue marke vpon texte ſayd immediatly rauens god feedeth yong one cry vnto true litle bird haue vnderſtanding cry vnto god nother haue ſpeach ſpeake much leſſe led cace true faith yet notwithſtanding much lacke foode haue mean ſuſteine themſelues world therfore ſayd crie vnto god according ſayd pſalme ſelfe ſame maner ſpeach vſed ſaying ought bee weyed well great confirmation thing haue bin ſayd wit god feede wylde beaſts houle crie bray without knowing maker ſhould nouriſh ought ſure god hath ſet worlde reſerueth ſelfe office maynteyning giuing ſo euer haue need thinke fayle agayne let v firſt marke ment worde crie rauens birdes crie vnto god vvhy ſo crie fayth vnderſtanding praye men taught crie want mean helpe thēſelues behold rauens bird hungred dāmes flie abroad ſeeke pray ſometimes finde none meane whyle yong one halfe ſtarued bodie prouideth nowe god fayne put helping hande whether bee giuing wormes iobbe ſome ſecret meanes thus yee ſee yong rauens crie vnto god like may ſayde beaſtes namely bee helpleſſe reſort vnto god vnderſtāding cace ſuch may well wander world ſtill deſtitute al ſuccour ſo ſhift god muſt reach hande goodneſſe giue thing haue neede let v returne foreſaid compariſon betweene ourſelues brute beaſts ſeeing ſayde god ſheweth himſelfe bountifull beaſtes deſtitute naturall meanes help themſelues one repayred vnto ought although haue abundance euen till readie perbrake good vp againe yet muſt wee alwayes vnderſtand thing haue giuen v god owne hande happen ſuffer penurie want ſo much prouoked repaire vnto therfore men muſt ſhrinke backe chafe vpō bridle find themſelues deſtitute help vvhat muſt let thinke thus themſelues behold god calleth v good ſoth declareth proteſteth mind ſort prouoke beaſts repayre vnto therein alſo ſhew himſelfe ſoueraine gouerner otherwiſe ſhuld leaue nothing world ſhould lie waſt howe much ought repayre vnto let v marke well whenſoeuer want prouiſion ſo wote become way turne v aſmuch god tolde v charge giue v whatſoeuer meete v ſame mean haue whole truſt ſettled wee haue ſuch beleef inward feeling prayer ſupplication muſt matched hand whoſoeuer braggeth wayteth ſuſtenance foode god hand yet meane vouchſafeth call vpon doth ſhew nothing el hypocriſie leaſing therfore fayth muſt ſtirre v vp driue v cal vpō god end may confeſſe foſterfather receyue foode hand vpon receyte thereof acknowlege ſelues nurriſhed mere goodneſſe thus yee ſee maner wee ought put text vre furthermore behoueth v come yet hygher compariſon ſith vnderſtand god feedeth bodyes ſorte muche reaſon wee ſhoulde alſo ſeeke nurriſhment ſoules hande although wee meate drinke worlde wee needed bow head filled yet foode ſoules precious thing found bylowe neuertheleſſe euen corruptible foode giuen v godshande hee ſheweth expreſly onely belongeth feede body preſent traſitorie life behoueth men repayre vnto cheefly fed ſpiritually haue conſideration skill v yong rauens fowles ayre beaſts worlde muſt witneſſes iudges condemne v god ſheweth v eyeſight calleth thē ſuccorleſſe hee call brute beaſtes ſo hee office behalfe ought wee haue right minde true beleefe towardes ſo wee may bee throughly perſwaded wee ſhall bee diſappoynted demaunding whatſoeuer wee haue neede effect wee haue remember text ſayd afterwarde knowest thou time wylde goates female doo kidde knowest thou tyme hyndes howe bowe themſelues caluingtyme truely example mankinde wee haue ourſelues ought ynough reproue mennes follie ſo ſelfewize take vpon reaſon god man ſhoulde aske howe wart thou created begotten wart thou caried nurriſhed ſpace nine monethes thou wart begotten haddeſt taken ſhape thy mother womb howe cameſt thou agayne ende couldeſt thou anſwere directly theſe thing would ſtande abaſhed man without ſtepping whit himſelfe ſhal finde ſufficiently proued god worketh wonderouſly begetting vvhat thing little creature ſhould bee ingendred yea euen corruption filthe yet notwithſtanding receyue ſuch ſhape wee ſee faſhioned body agayne thing childe ſhoulde bee nurriſhed vncleanneſſe infection mother wombe euen among excrement yet notwithſtanding receyue ſuſtenance growe ſo big finde meanes come world maner thing theſe ſuch excellent miracle god ought bee rauiſhed therefore haue ſayde already wee needed bee ſent wilde beaſtes hyndes sheegoates bene ynough euery v conſidered maner hee borne nurriſhed mother wombe hee came mother worlde neuertheleſſe without cauſe god ſendeth v wilde beaſtes woman haue yet ſome helpe come deliuerance haue woman ſeruice one ſuccour another agayne bee taught cuſtome experience keepe themſelues daungers conſider expedient prepare furniſh themſelues aforehand yee ſee ſame ought eſteemed greter miracle brute beaſts woman poore beaſts great yong know beare onely feele cūberſome burthen may greeued may ruſh belly agaynſt ſomething make yong one ſlinke ſtruggling yong one within may maner caſt deſpayre howbeeit god preſerueth ſuch wize keepe theyr frute although ſame heauie troubleſome thē yet preſerued 〈…〉 miracle ſeene redde deere ••• ne hyndes cannot indure owne fatneſſe▪ ſomuche growe fatte fal faſting propertie cannot beare thing hindereth yet notwithſtanding carie theyr yong calues ſtill yea euen great payne ſpecially reported haue exceeding great payne greefe caluing according alſo mention made thereof text ſayd howe themſelves though ſhoulde cliue aſunder ſtrayne themſelues exceeding ſore true woman alſo ſayne ſtreyne themſelues ſtreyning hyndes greater ſomuch haue skill ſecretes nature ſay fayne vſe medecine taking certayne hearb help themſelues withall otherwiſe ſhould ſtand ſtay tooke ſomewhat haſte deliuerie vvee ſee heere nought god ſendeth menne hyndes sheegoates kinde altogither certayne matter importance ſtraunge cace beaſtes know beare ſhould notwithſtanding haue wit beare burthen fence themſelues againſt though god taught ſayd vnto behoueth preſerue owne kinde offpring seing beaſtes haue ſuche inclination god worketh aboue woulde become gouerned againe beaſts come bee deliuered brutiſhneſſe ſuche telling muſte keepe thēſelues
