quiet muſte haue yong one ſhall bee gladde ſayde vnto woman ſhall haue wherof reioyce ſee manchilde borne worlde none theſe thing bee ſayde beaſtes knowe ſhall paſſe body nother tell whither thing carie ſhall burſt belly make bowells fal yet notwithſtāding keepe ſtil afterward come bringing foorth yong know remedy needes without ſuccour make yong one cleane peyne haue yet go abroade ſo miſcarie default seing wee perceyue haue wee cauſe magnifie god ſpecially wee conſider diuerſitie beaſtes yet ſee multiplie maner pray proued face god ſtretcheth arme worketh way miracle neede go ſchoole vnderſtād neede high capacitie haue matter debated great profound reaſons ſo ſlenderwitted ignorant perſon knoweth well begetting menne ingendering cattell beaſtes miracle god god hand muſt needes perceyued according alſo beareth whole ſway knowing ought • alſo wonder goodneſſe god extendeth ſelfe euen brute beaſts vvhen wee ſee pitifull behalfe ought wee glorifie ſame 〈…〉 wee leaſtwize yeeld ſacrifyze prayſe ſee power wiſedome lo howe ignoranteſt conuicted vnthankefulneſſe ſet minde conſidering god wiſedome power iuſtice goodneſſe ſhewe vtter themſelues euety yea euen toward brute beaſts although mention made preciſely hind ſhee rockegoates wilde goates yet haue wee generall leſſon gather beaſtes namely god muſte needes ſtretch hand guyding ſayde order intendeth multiply liuing creature guyding thereof haue ofſpring increace without ſome guyding thing woulde come horrible confuzion ſpecially ſith wee know ſayd ſecrettes peculiar difficulty hyndes ouer beaſts ſayd afore therefore god giueth skill ſeeke ſayd hearbe let v profite ſelues knowledge hath beene phiſitiō hyndes ſchoole haue learned skill ſeeke hearb know expedient deliuerie voyding yōg one body vvho hath ſhewed vvho hath beene teacher ought god knowne glorified cace wee ought marke well theſe particular kindes ſet downe heere eye wherein god glory ſheweth ſelfe liuely yet muſt alſo gather foreſayd generall leſſon god worketh throughout ſhall bee ſayd hereafter egges fowles lay whereoutof yong birdes come euen alſo muſt god prouidēce acknowledged howbeit haue ſo applyed whole indeuer conſider god doings wilde beaſts behoueth v alſo come backe ſelues cheefe poynt men ſhould know god goodneſſe power wiſdome iuſtice according bee ſhewed vnto perceyue partaker therfore whereas ſayde heere caluing tyme hyndes knowne vnto men ſay men appoynt let v vnderſtand muſt trie mayſtries god going aboute wreſte ourſelues ſubiection wee borne god hath ſhewed life owne hande order diſpoſition well ynough knowne long tyme hyndes go calfe men may iudge certayne coniecture men looke ſo narrowly man marke time male female go rutte hee ſhall finde go full eight moneths well caluingtime may wel knowne ſayd knowest thou caluing tyme hyndes yea purpoſe god ſpeaketh yet hath ſo ordered v know long hynds ſhould go calfe ſay haue appoynted eyther monethes dayes vve bee skilfull folke nowe ſeing god haue hyndes go calfe full ſuch time terme expi • ed deliuereth giuing thē helpes guyding matter himſelfe hath ordeyned behoueth v conclude therevpon hath reſerued lordſhip beaſts himſelfe aſmuch fedde dammes belly holdeth ſubiection bee come foorth ſo guydeth owne pleaſure whē haue ſo thought vpon beaſtes lette v come ſelues would fayne ſtart play ſuttleheaded fellow replying againſt god ſaying doth god deale thus thus mee vvhy doth hee ſende mee mine owne deſires enter ſuch murmuring lift vp ſelues faſhion againſt god let v come backe birth ſay ala howe cameſt thou thy mother wombe tooke thee true helpes yet muſt wee come ſayde two twentith pſalme god hād tooke v mother wombe woman worlde may beate braynes nothing cace except god worke euen wonderful power therfore thinke vpon birth muſt needes ſtroupe ſay lorde came world thou diddeſt well ſhewe thy guiding cace thou tookeſt mee mother womb yea whyle thou diddeſt maynteyne mee vvere paſsing ſtraunge thing ſhetting vp child ordinarie ▪matter among v vvee liue ayre whenſoeuer cannot take breath choked hand▪ life man conſiſteth breath ſtop breath diſpatched immediatly true little babe haue ſome vent take breath mother wombe whereby euen nauill meane wherewith childe ſuſteyned maner corruption hee lieth among maner excrement kinde wretchedneſſe ſomuch conſidered borne ſpace eyght moneths howe hee maynteyned man may ſee god mightie hande yea ſo paſsingly wee muſt needes bee amazed thinke vpon acknowledge god gouerneth thing hath ordering v wee bee moued ſuch ſo mightie workes god ſtand aſtoniſhed pray muſt wee needes bee worſe hardharted wee bee touched owne record brute beaſts muſt condemne v beare witneſſe agaynſt v laſt day let v learne profit ſelues doctrine ſpecially confeſſe god wonderful woorkes order nature ſuch tootingglaſſe wee muſt needes rauiſhed wonder knowledge thing ſeene howbeit let v alwayes knit vp bridling ſelues knowing certaine wee power wit capacitie iudge god doings therefore wee muſt ſall controlling aske done let v vnderſtand ſoeuer go find fault doings ſhall bee confounded yea bee driuen perceyue owne ignorance weakeneſſe euen vndoing wee preſume auaunce ſelues beyond bound ſith ſo let v learne contēted pleaſeth god reueale vnto v let v reſtreyne ſelues diueliſh ouerweening ſee ſome men ſpecially cace concerneth matter paſſe capacitie like ſayde god doth ſo diſpoze thing v finde fault doings notwithſtanding bee guyded performed prouidence herevpō ſome reply mee cānot beleeue vnderſtand therefore conclude naught howe thou vnhappie wight wilt thou ſhet vp god ſo ſmall roome thy fooliſh brayne one thou ſhuldſt ſay beleeue god except may ſee mine eye betweene legges dealing wee muſt ſo vve muſt preſume draw downe god maieſtie vnto v behoueth v mount vp alofte ſend vp wittes thither honour incomprehenſible greatneſſe yea wee muſte mount vp thither humilitie without preſuming thing ſelues rather acknowledging nothing creepe bylow thus ye ſee behoueth v put doctrine vre according alſo ſet v ſame end letvs fal face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying open eye wee may learne perceyue howe ought ſo beaten want wretchedneſſe wee may cleerely bereft pride ſo wee attempt waunt ſelues chalendge thing vnto v acknowledging goodneſſe v altogither vnprofitable may reſorte good god receyue power ſtrengh hande follow ende walking according ſame wee may brought yeelde prayſe thankeſgiuing thereof may pleaſe tame pride v hindereth v prayſe deſerueth end v made cleane may returne vnto one cōmon accord framing ſelues pe • ſably vnto woord may pleaſe c clij sermon ſecond vpon xxxix chapter 8 vvho hath ſet vvild aſſe libertie vvho hath loozed bondes vvild aſſe 9 vvhich haue ſet houſe vvilderneſſe dvvelling ſalt place 10 laugheth multitude citie skorne heareth crie extorcioner 11 ſeeketh mountaynes paſture ſearcheth euery greene thing 12 vvill vnicorne ſerue thee vvill tarie thy crib 13 canſt thou tie ſayd vnicorne vvith line labour furrovves vvill hee breake cloddes earth vallies thee 14 vvilt thou truſt bicauſe ſtrength great yeeld vp thy labour vnto 15 vvilt thou beleeue vvill bring homethy corne gather togither thy barne 16 haſt thou giuen peacock goodly vvinges feather storck eſtrich 17 vvhich leaueth hir egges earth maketh vvhot duſt 18 forgetteth foote maye treade vppon beaſt fielde maye breake 19 shee ſhevveth hir ſelfe cruell tovvards hir yong one though vvere hirs though hir labouring vvere vayne vvithout feare 20 god hath depriued hir vviſedome giuen hir vnderſtanding 21 vvhen time ſhee mounteth high skorneth horſe rider ſome one onely kinde thing looke vpō whole world yet ought ſame ſuffyze make v giue glorie vnto god anythīg wherein ſheweth himſelfe ſuch one towards v wee compelled honour god perceyuing men ſtill negligent ſlowe knowing purpoſed ſtirre vp ſuche varietie ſhould excuze themſelues knowing ſeene infinite number thing offer thēſelues ſight aboue beneath ſay man thinke vpon himſelf without paſsing ſhould well haue wherfore magnifie god elſe hee looked vppon one kinde creature wee may ſay like wee make circuites diſcourſes haue ſeene god glory one part world wee turne eyeſight another make numbering peruſing creature certayne wee muſt needes moued confeſſe ſuch perfection workes v able magnifie ſufficiently lo god doth ſet v downe many ſundrie ſortes perfect ſtorie full reckening vp property liuing thing yet notwithſtā ding example ſet downe haue ſo much ought ſuffyze v like mention made wilde vntamed aſſes god ſayeth v giue libertie one ſayd behold wild aſſes muſt thinke whole world gathered togither could giue wilde aſſes ſuch nature haue therfore lette v confeſſe god hath diſpoſed thing aboue abilitie power finding fault commeth fooliſh raſhneſſe v lyft v • eye honour ſheweth v ſo infinite power mightineſſe mention made wilde aſſes hee ſpeaketh vnicornes ſome ſuch kinde beaſt bee men commonly agree vnicorne ſpoken ſayd vnicornes ſubiection v wee cannot occupie wee ox horſes aſſes meanes tame might till ground drawe home corne ••• ne vnto threſhingfloore sith ſo let v vnderſtand v ouerrule god workes wee may well ſtreyne ſelues ſhall neuer bring paſſe wee cannot tame wilde aſſe ſome wood beaſt ſhall rule whole worlde wee cannot dare wee lift vp neb againſt maker hath ordered thing ſuch wiſedome fault foūd finally ſpeaketh peacock estridges el ſome haue vnderſtood storkes howbeeit although storkes ſpoken ſecond place yet notwithſtanding thing added ende cannot agree eſtridges wit despiſe horſe ••• ſeman reaſon ſwiſtneſſe agayne forget egges ſo fooliſh lay san • e thinke great fondneſſe ſoule agreeth eſtridges rather storkes effect one mirrour god glory able content men leaſtwiſe great varietie ſheweth felfe euerywhere ought ſtirre v vp moue v ſeeke god ſubmit ſelues haue founde yea euen ſuch obedience although perceyue reaſon work yet may ceaſſe hold ſelues priſoners ſo grudge againſt wyze let v come euery part vvhere wilde aſſes ſpoken ſayde god vntie •• ſetteth libertie go ſeeke feeding mountaynes dwell wilderneſſes ſalt place therewithall skorne ſuch city ſubiect tallages impoſts ſuch charge wilde aſſes knowe theſe thing meane haue free ſtate god ſpeaketh maner rebuke men ſetting themſelues forgetting owne ſtate moſt men vnderlings yet wee ſee brag themſelues ſo ſeemeth earth woorthie beare whereof commeth ſuch ouerweening compare themſelues wilde aſſes ſhall find aſſes haue deſirable thing haue wit libertie freedome euery man cōfeſſeth freedome chief benefite enioy ſo wee bondage wilde aſſes free yet notwithſtanding fal boaſting beare ſelues hand ſuch excellent woorthineſſe v ought bee caried aboue clowdes god ought reach hand ſet v vpon ſhoulders thus ſee wee folie men behalfe therefore lette v marke well god ment humble v correct pryde v bicauſe cannot refrayne frō eſteeming ſelues beyond meaſure bicauſe wee thinke vpon vpon workes howbeeit neede mount ſo high vnto maieſtie humble v beaſts teach v ſchoolemayſters wee woorthie haue teacher neuertheleſſe might bee de maunder whither wilde aſſes preferred • rome abroade euery hilde awe ſubiection bee tamed man anſwere men continued vncorruptneſſe ſhould haue beene ſubiect reaſon way bondage euery man ſhould haue ſuch rule himſelf god ſhould haue reigned euerywhere ſhoulde haue needed lawes iuſticers ſwoorde haue executed menne euill ſhoulde haue needed none thoſe thing euery man ſhould haue bene lawe rule himſelfe ſhould haue god lawe printed hart ſuch willing ſubiection ſhould haue bene noble excellent dominion world aſmuch wee corrupted behoueth v hilde thraldome therein god ſheweth v wee bee able rule ſelues ſith haue v brought vnder awe others onely lawes ciuill order men hild vnder yoke▪ alſo god ſuffereth hard comberſome charge layd vpon according ſee druerſe time tyrant beare ſway world ſo farre father ſubiects vexe pill poll bite aſmuch behalfe ſtate ſerueth ſhame v god teacheth telleth v beaſts ſome reſpect haue better time yet notwithſtanding ſayd god hath reſpects ſo vtterly reiected mē beaſts better cace wee ſee hee compareth people iſrael wilde aſſe prophete oſee ſhewe nother reaſon manhood thou wilt alone thy ſelfe ſayeth ſay cannot tame thee lord intendeth hold v flocke haue woord meening play teacher among v wee cannot abide gouerned hand againſt kinde wee ſhew ſelues haue vnamendable nature moreouer certayne ſubiection god hath layd vpon men wee ſee ſtill ſome print goodneſſe ſo much mennes behoof ſubiect yea though handled amiſſe rigorouſly wilde aſſes bee ſo vntamed ſtray abrode mountaynes meane men warned ſinnes god chaſtizeth roughly mayne blowes ſo draw backe repentance againe whatſoeuer come ſheweth difference betweene good euill whereas aſſes let alone ſtill brutiſhneſ • e let v learne whatſoeuer ſubiection god hath layd vpon men yet hath ceaſſed vſe continuall goodneſſe fauour towards howbeeit warning giuen text tendeth poynt men needes bee prowde make great account owne worthineſſe nobilitie deſerue well bee ſent wilde aſſes god ſhould mocke ſaying go ye wretched ſoules ſeemeth ought reygne ouer ought fellowlike yet ſhall ſubiect many charge ye ſhall able liue togither without many trouble complayntes outcry euery man ſhall ſtand doubt according wee ſee men cannot liue one another ſhall miſtruſt hartburning one ſhall another wrong guyle ſtill practizing one thing indeuering ouercome enimies treacherie maliciouſneſſe ſo full poyſon grinde teeth ſee cannot redreſſe owne harmes lo ſtate men meane wilde aſſes ſport themſelues mountaynes ſeeking paſture ſcorning policy wherewith men tyre themſelues ſo much ſeing ſo let v learne ſet leſſe ſelues wilde aſſes wander mountaynes muſt teach leſſon make perceyue ye ſuch weene ſelues ſhould make ſuch vaunting wee ſee maner behoueth v apply text inſtructiō one ſide let v vnderſtand god intendeth humble v example beaſts ende ſub due pryde v ſide let v conſider although ſtate bee ſome reſpect woorſe ſtate br • te beaſts yet notwithſtanding god neuer ceaſſeth holde graciouſgoodneſſe towardes v turne euill intoo good ſomuch whereas wee haue free vnbridled life worlde meanes wee bee taught come ſo vnto ſubiection men becommeth better libertie beaſts bō dage behoofe beaſtes ſtray abroade without mayſter reſtreynt without knowing lawe aught elſe thus yee ſee one ſide wee haue conſider god grace ſide ſtoupe wee exalt ſelues worthineſſe vnderſtand lord ſubdueth v himſelf mention hath beene made ſort wilde aſſes ſpeaking vnicornes matter like vnto god ſayeth vnicorne cannot bee tamed wee cannot vſe commoditie although ſtrong light yet bee till earth pleaſure drawe plough nother draw carte bring home come barne ſhort hee ſerue man turne altogither himſelfe heere wee haue note firſt whereas beaſts v ſeruice bicauſe god tameth putteth hand end wee ſhould inioy proofe thereof doth horſe ſuffer himſelfe bee ruled man draw plough harrowes carie rider burthen backe happeneth men breake mule aſſes ox horſe ſtrong ynough withſtand man wee ſee hee ſtoute coragious beaſt howe doth man get mayſtrie ſurely man acquaynted taming ox horne terrible thing look • vpon ſhaking head ynough 〈…〉 abaſhe man great eye thicke neckes would agaſt ſhould bend horne ynough runne came neere againe ſee huge body haue could men haue vſe pleaſed god giue v mayſtrie well might vnicornes tamed horſes ox god giuen diuerſe nature let v behold god goodneſſe applying thoſe beaſts ſeruice otherwiſe able amaſe v looke ſo durſt come neere little childe rule ox ſomuch accuſtomed yoke ſhall keepe thē little ſticke hee ſhall make bow downe thicke neckes ſtoupe brode horne ſhort ſhall weelde ſuch ſorte whereas able beare downe thing afore ſhall reſiſtance sith wee ſee let v acknowledge god hath ſhewed himſelf bountifull towardes v ſeing hee hath maner made ſuch beaſts ſubiect v able haue made v afrayde ſayd afore neuertheleſſe haue apply themſelues ſeruice ſo menne may tame beholde elephant tamed paſsing terrible beaſt looke ouercommeth beaſts truly mountayne ſeemeth ſerue purpoſe deſtroy v yet notwithſtanding▪ ſubdued becōmeth ſort tame hee keepeth ſtill ſome incling owne kinde yet wonder v mā ſome maner ouermayſter make ſerue turne contrary part vnicorne ſmall beaſt hauing certaine nimbleneſſe keepeth alwayes ſturdineſſe ſomuch men world cannot cunning ſtrength bring ſubiection sith wee ſee let v conuicted leaſtwiſe ſuch compariſon haue learned acknowledge god goodneſſe applieth beaſts vſe profite v ſeruice lette v marke alſo ſide v rule snayle ye would ſay lord giue v power ouer true creation worlde beaſts giuen vnto adam haue lordſhip dominion ouer haue loſt poſſeſsion thereof gone away god like ſubiect committeth lewdneſſe treaſon agaynſt prince good forfeyted himſelfe quite fauour euen ſo men ſhould haue reigned peaſably ouer beaſts beene vnthankefull god breaking allegeance wee ought vnto cauſe wee bereft lordſhip ſouerayntie giuen v ouer beaſts nowe ſeing beaſts ſhould riſe vp againſt v wee could inioy god reſerueth vſe vntoo v yea ſubdueth ſome v according wee haue neede thereby wee warned exceeding great madneſſe v lift vp ſelues againſt maker beaſts well ouermaiſter v neede require god needeth arme lion vnicornes giue v battell lyce flea hee thinke good ſo make ſcorne pryde therefore ſeing ſometimes cannot mean rule beaſts lette v remember whence ſame commeth wit adam ſinne naughtineſſe wee ſtubborne agaynſt made v prince worlde put creature hande let v conſider ſorie ſinnes oft wilde beaſts v harme let v thinke v thus behold god ſheweth v owne want therevpon lette v pray graunt v grace obey ſuch wiſe may beare mark beaſts may know power hath giuen v child yet lette v aſſure ſelues intendeth holde v alwayes awe lo haue marke ſecond place mā might aske queſtion god keepeth ſtill ſuch kinde beaſtes ſeing men ſeruice ſhoulde ſeeme cauſe ceaſſeth god ſhoulde nurriſh longer let v marke ceaſſe bentifyings world end men might behold maieſtie god one reaſon ſufficient ynough ſelfe againe haue ſayde already ſerue learning god ſheweth v diuerſe ſights teach v varietie vnderſtand power goodneſſe iuſtice better ſide good inſtruction v bicauſe ſith cannot haue vſe muſt preſume exalt ſelues high euen horſes ox would ruſhe againſt v ouerrun v ſomuch although god haue put vnder v haue ſerue v yet notwithſtanding one ſtroke horſes foote ynough ſlea man sith wee ſee haue wee alwayes good leſſon ſhrinke head giue ouer making great braueries yee ſee wee haue beare away heere furthermore whereas mention made breaking cleddes tilling ground carying corne barne ende men ſhould bee better warned neede prouided many help god hand vvee could continue world meate drinke could liue two dayes nurriſhed hee giueth v bread men ſo able themſelues till earth alone may well imploy ſtrength armes may well digge delue ala ynough make corne growe ſuſtenance ſhall clothe tilling earth ſhall get coates hozen ſhooes ſhall furniſh neceſſaries wee ſee ſubiect ſo many thing onely meate drinke ſerue turne vvhat number helpes haue wee neede mainteyne v wretched life conſidering god neede giue v ſuche innumerable ſorte helpes let v therfore thinke vpon great number benefites hee hath beſtowed vpon v hath ordeyned horſes ox till grounde v bring home corne barnes furthermore giuen v ſuch skilfulneſſe wee haue done amiſſe haue remedie hand seing god hath made v beholde goodneſſe maner eye let v alſo cōſider deepely wee bound indetted vnto ſerue lowlineſſe behold chiefe poynt ſhewed v booke menne ſhall neuer yeeld god due honour except ſtoupe vntoo without preſuming grudge againſt without taking vppon teach leſſon vndoubtedly ſchoole hee ought come vnto hee hath ſuch wiſedome himſelfe hath bene ſhewed heretofore ſhall ſhewed hereafter conſtreyned ſay wee conſtreyned abaſhed ſight god doings wee abaſhed behalfe ſo alſo behoueth v learne glorifie wee let v come ſayd peacockes estridges vvho hee ſayeth god hath giuen ſo goodly wing peacockes god ſheweth v one woord one fether ynough proue v ſtarke fooles cannot contented doings let v looke vppon peacockes fether ſo wonderfull workemanſhip ſame wote ſay glorifie god ſay euen vnbeleeuers compelled therevntoseing ſo pray wittes able reache ſo high skanning god gouerneth world thing much higher without compariſon muſt notneedes come ſhort one feather peacocke rauiſh v hold v gaze ſhall workemanſhip appeareth whole worlde ſhall ſpeciall gouerning mankind yet notwithſtāding thing whereat men vtter blaſphemies thing chafe ſtorme againſt god beyng deſirous hee ſhould gouerne aduice fancie bicauſe haue owne liking dealt god hand thēſelues would wiſh yet muſt wee needes proued haue fayled duetie wee conſider hee telleth v thus yee ſee god meening texte afterward hee maketh compariſon winges estridges rather ſtay vpon added concerning fondneſſe lightneſſe ſtrength alſo ſpeaketh storkes may rather bring v reaſonableneſſe kindneſſe bee found oftentimes men yong storkes growen great reknowledge dammes feede old age requite youth surely well cōſidered needed none doctrine condemne vnthankfulneſſe child ſtubborne father mother could finde heart bottome sea therfore would loth ſpend themſelues behalf ſpare meate mouth giue vnto ye ſee fayre mirrour wee haue birde guiltie ſeing acknowledge ſouerayne father created v nurriſheth v whoſe hand wexeth old hee might haue neede v giueth v innumerable good thinges conſider ſomuch yeelde due prayſe ſeing ſo lewde froward neede witneſſes storkes condemne v howbeit aſmuch god ſtrayeth longer vpō eſtriche lette v come ſpoken behold ſayeth hee estrich mocketh horſe rider ſerueth ſhew nimbleneſſe great birdbeaſt half bird ayre half beaſt earth hee hath ſuch weightie bodie mount vp flie aloft flickereth ſuch wiſe hee cannot bee outgone man may well runne poſte hee cannot ouertake halfe leaping vppon clees halfe flying winges paſſeth ſwiftneſſe bee horſes beaſtes marke one poynt ſame ſwiftneſſe matched pollicie ſo thoſe beaſtes take vp ſtones way throwe ſuch follow thus ſee yee two thing birdbeaſt one ſide fooliſhneſſe howbeeit matched aduiſedneſſe gathering vp ſtones runneth caſting backward ſuch purſue ſay one wonderfull thing ſeene eſtridges otherſide ſuch fooliſhneſſe may hide head thinke body hidden yet huge carkeſſes ſeene ſtill touching egges ſitte vpō aſmuch keepe whote country hide ſand sunne giuing warmth vnto doth meanes hath mā conſider one ſide ſorecaſt theſe birdbeaſts defending themſelues otherſide fooliſhneſſe hiding egges ſhall hee ſee wonderfull worke god guyding ſort furthermore whereas mention made ſtrength ſwiftneſſe birdbeaſt lette v vnderſtande thoſe thing ſurmounteth v vve may well make brag eſtriches go beyond v cace marke one poynt men muſt ſet ſo much ſtore themſelues haue beene wont god ſende backe continually theſe example ſerue mocke fooliſh boaſting otherſide wee ſee theſe birdbeaſts haue ſtrength nimbleneſſe yea policie alſo thing ſo fond one poynt ſhewe nother wit skill ought wee glorifie god goodneſſe towards v hath giuen v vnderſtanding eſtridges haue haue menne gotten owne power eyther gold siluer buy ſuch marchaundize let euery man acknowledge much wee bee bound vnto god giuing v ſuch diſcretion lette v beare minde behoueth v yeelde due prayſe thus ye ſee god meening text alſo whereas ſayd god hath bereft estrich wiſedome let v vnderſtand warne v aſmuch wee haue reaſon diſcretion wee bee ſo much bound vnto god giuing v ſo ineſtimable benefite priuiledge thing diſcerne betweene good euill know duetie onely walking worlde alſo attayne euerlaſting lyfe principal thing know god hath created v owne image prepared heritage v aboue seing wee haue skill diſcerne betweene honeſtie diſhoneſtie betweene vice vertue moreouer god doth ſo inlighten v holy ſpirite heauens aſort opened vnto v paſſe aboue world come companie angelles endleſſe glorie purchaced v lord ieſus chriſt aſmuch ſay wee haue much ought wee make ſuch treaſure way giueth v haue erſt ſayde wee ſhould bee lyke theſe fooliſhe birdbeaſtes ſpoken heere wee ſhoulde haue witte eſtriches god prouideth otherwyſe v thus yee ſee howe men ought bridle themſelues apply wit reaſon honoring god aduaunce themſelues agaynſt cheefe thing muſte obey conſider infirmitie ſtill themſelues ynough ſome ſmall quantitie diſcerne greatneſſe height god workes creeping vpon earth go foreward ſtill hūbleneſſe modeſtie knowing well cannot yet atteyne depth god ſecretes thing touched beginning better confirmation texte namely god one ſide intendeth make v perceyue goodneſſe ende wee ſhould haue cauſe greeued patience though giuen better ſtate wilde beaſts v yet neuertheleſſe intent humble v wee ſee ſerues ſuch plight reaſon corruption wee caught ſinne beaſtes paſſe v ſome reſpects particular poynts true wee ſhall alwayes bee preferred beaſtes bee placed higher degree aboue yea whereas haue ſo great ſtrength nimbleneſſe beaſts haue ſame profite wit humble v withall otherwiſe wee would neuer bee tamed vve ſee although wee put minde weakeneſſe many thing wee behold yet notwithſtanding god fayne complayne v like wilde beaſts hath bene ſayde woorſe oxe know owner cribbe hee fedde aſſe horſe know mayſters ſtable know maker ſhort meanes tame v therefore good v wee haue ſuch force ſtrength wilde beaſtes haue thing could delt withall moreouer way let v alwayes beare minde wee muſt haue recourſe number benefites god hath ſpecially beſtowed vpon v vpon beaſts according ſayde heere reaſon vnderſtanding howbeeit lette v ſimply conſider reaſon common men let v alſo come hath pleaſed god inlighten v wiſedome conteyned goſpell open eye holy ſpirite ſo wee bee able ſee ſecretes elſe ſhould hidden incomprehenſible v therfore let v learne magnifie ſame theſe two thing haue beare minde way lette v marke whereas mention made heere estridges egges god extend prouidence hatching hir egges euen left forſaken much likely hee neuer forget v v ſay excellent creature good ſooth wee ſee hee hath prouided much better mankind thoſe cattell behold hennes ſo fooliſh forget owne egges chicken ſhoulde come lord hath printed kindneſſe woman know yong babe nurriſh bloud ſubſtance seing lord hath ſet ſuch order mankind thereby wee know hee hath fatherly care v howbeeit wee muſte meaſure goodneſſe let v come ſayeth prophet mother forget hir child although al mother world ſhould forget child yet forſake thee ſayeth lord god one ſide ſheweth himſelfe father holdeth mother ſuch ſtay giuing themſelues willingly charge nurcing child true ſee mother number theſe tender nice thing cannot finde heart take payne owne child nurce ſhall bee kinde childe none hir owne thā owne mother neuertheleſſe ſayd kindneſſe appeereth commonly whence proceedeth euen god whoſe maynteyne mankinde meane moreouer wee know fatherly goodneſſe ſheweth ſelfe creature well ſurely god doth afore hande make v feele fauour care hee hath v howbeit let v vnderſtand himſelfe ſurmounteth euer perceyue worlde wee come vnto humbleneſſe hee alwayes ſhewe himſelfe wit welſpring mercie pitie aduerſities ſuccour v therefore let v haue ſayd truſt although wretched creature yet let v therfore ceaſſe truſt glorifie aſſuring ourſelues yeeld v teachable obedient people ſide ſhewe v acknowledging god vayne let v fall face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying make v feele better generally open eye wee may puffed vp pryde preſumption drunken vayne fancy ſtande owne conceyt boaſt ſelues wee may rather learne ſubmitte ſelues holde goodes honour acknowledging continue mercie towards v vtterly vndone euery minute houre meane wee may bee alwayes hild feare ſubiection profite therein moreouer hee may vouchſafe beare v ſtill ſo long ſeeth v yet hemmed ſo many infirmity corruptiōs vntill haue vtterly bereft v tranſformed v vntoo glory image may pleaſe graunt grace v alſo people nation earth bringing backe poore ignorant ſoules miſerable c cliij sermon third vpon the▪ xxxix chapter 22 haſt thou giuen ſtrength horſe inuironed necke vvith neying 23 vvilt thou make horſe afrayd graſſehopper locuſt neying noſthrilles terrible 24 diggeth earth foote reioiceth goeth boldneſſe armed mā 25 paſſeth ſcaring feareth nother ſhunneth ſvvoord 26 let quiuer rattle ſteele ſpeare ſhield 27 hee ſvvallovveth vp earth rage fierceneſſe hee paſſeth noyze trumpet 28 vvhen heareth trumpet ſayeth ha ha ſmelleth battell far noyze captaynes ſhouting armie 29 vvill hauke take fethers thy vviſedome vvill hee ſpred vvngs tovvardes south 30 vvill eagle mounte vp thy commaundement make hir neſt high place 31 shee dvvelleth vpon rocke abideth vpon high mountaynes infortreſſes 32 thence ſhee eſpieth hir pray hir eye looke farre 33 hir yong one ſucke vp bloud haunt vvhere dead body 34 lorde anſvvered ſayde vnto iob 35 learning ſtriue vvith almightie let reproueth god anſvvere diſpozed bee taught god hee alſo parte woulde deale ſo v teaching ſhoulde lift v vp hande vnto himſelfe yea ſo familiar faſhion father talketh child howbeit foraſmuch harde bee gouerned ſteade yeelding ſelues teachable needes ouerwize god fayne ſend v ſchoole beaſts haue ſeene heretofore proceedeth heere ſtill ſpeaking horſes theyr nature hee ſheweth men know workes wil nedes auaunce themſelues ſorte agaynſt therewithall ſheweth vnleſſe pleaſe hee vouchſafe anſwere replyes ſhall ynough v diſproued brute beaſtes yea euen horſes houſehold v ſo ſhall neede go farre ſtoppe mouthes ſhal haue aduocates inough plead cace ſtretes field houſes wil ray ſevp great oratours among men ſayde content himſelfe haue brute beaſtes pleade furthermore curious diſcourſing nature horſes god ment deale ſuch manner proceſſe hee alleadgeth ſimplye thing knowne ignoranteſt ſorte man neede greatly practiſed vnderſtanding thing ſpoken heere little child knowe like ſpake ſtarres planet manner greate doctours philoſophers vvhy ſo bicauſe fewe folke ſhould haue fared better haue capacitie conceyue hee ſpake groſly sunne moone thing ſeene vvhoſoeuer hath eye although haue nother skill aught elſe bee greate clerke may notwithſtanding comprehende thing haue bin ſpoken alredy concerning sunne starres needeth aſtrologie behalfe like cace ſpeaketh beaſts kepeth ſelf ſame courſe intent none v ſhoulde take excuſe wherevnto wee inclined truely men lothe confeſſe owne ignorance yet commeth excuzing themſelues god make buckler ſaying paſſeth mine vnderſtanding curious geere mee cannot faſten vppon foraſmuche moſte men take ſuch lurkingholes ſayeth euen ignoranteſt ſort ſhal haue proued face haue bin vnthankfull malicious haue knowne thing vtterly apparant vntoo thus ye ſee cauſe mention made heere horſes thing rehearſed ſimply ſuche ſorte bee knowne men bothe great ſmall yea ſayeth god man giue ſuch ſtrength ſeene horſes ſpeciall giue ſo luſtie coragious nature beſides horſes ſtrong limmes wee ſee partly bred purpoſe warres men ſee howe caſte themſelues middes daunger inflamed ſuch furiouſneſſe man woulde ſay one minde trumpettes greate ſhoutes yea 〈◊〉 doo euen incourage men sith wee ſee 〈◊〉 terribleneſſe euen nozethrils ſo dreadful beaſt himſelfe yet men know ſmall peece god working behalfe hath vttered power full hath onely giuen little ſigne marke hee able men conſider throughly ought ſtryue checke dare nowe ſet themſelues againſt liuing god durſt anſwere horſe durſt rubbe vpon backe woulde bee afrayde yet afrayde infinite power whereof ſee ſmall droppe horſes worlde ye ſee haue remember effect vpon ſtreyne euen ſame wee ſee god hath vſed ſuperfluous language ſpeaking heere hardineſſe horſes theyr ſtrength men cannot ſcare graſſehoppers runne vppon ſpeares arrowes needefull ſpeake ſo wee bee hardie bolde ynough carpe god knowe glory▪ owne blockiſhneſſe giueth v boldeneſſe aſmuche drawe curtayne eye whiche keepeth v frō ſight god glorie thing maketh v ſo brutiſhe bycauſe playe ſharpſighted men nedes comprehende thing owne fancie knowe infinite power god therefore doth god treate horſes ſet v ſtrength power ſo ende ſhould rauiſhed wondering guyding behoueth v alwayes come backe poynt god hath vttered power altogither horſes giuen v vnderſtand vttermoſt able hath ſet forth one drop prouidence yet cōſider well ſayd accuſtomed ſight handling horſes euery v woulde runne away would terrible beaſts v ſpecially ſight theyr boldneſſe ſhew battell thus yee ſee muſte apply thing inſtructiō rehearſed particularly cōcerning horſes yea ſide muſt note goodneſſe god tameth horſes ſort ſubdue thē vnto men apply ſeruice thinke wee horſe whiche vntame nature yea bred purpoſe battell would ſuffer himſelfe bee ſo ruled weelded god cooled great corage intent men turnes might ſerued durſt doo ourſelues let v cōclude god ſheweth v power hath giuen ſuch boldnes vnto horſes made ſo fierce hath alſo giuen v ſingular record goodneſſe loue nothing able breake horſes maner owne vſe ſo ſuffer v trauell put chariot carte labour tilling ground take backes ride vpon seing horſes ſuffer thēſelues ſo gouerned doubt lord ſheweth v beneficiall towards v maketh v know thus much concerning poynt chiefe poynt leſſon haue touched namely ſame muſt ſerue v repreſſe boldneſſe therfore tempted murmur againſt god gaynſay thing muſt caſt eye vpon brute beaſts cā teach v alſo worthie ſuch ſchooling harken peaceably god obey ſimple voyce afterward ſpeaketh haukes eagle hast thou ſayth giuen wing hauke fly thy commaundement ſoreth towards south ſemeth would ſtie vp sunne hast thou ſhaped eagle ſayeth thou giuest nestes rockes tower mountaines ſay high loftie place art thou able ſet ſuch order nature wheras yong one feede vpō bloud bredde thervnto thou haſt invred fedde nurriſhed ſuche ſuſtenance eagle finde dead body ſmell farre yea ſo ſharpſighted • e able ſpie euerywhere ſurely certaine foule hath ſharpeſt ſighte others thou hath giuen ſuch nature eagle ſayth god vve ſee god aboue beneath offereth v mirrours rather liuely image wherein wee may perceyue mightie power humble ourſelues yet notwithſtā ding muſt cōſider alſo ſame wherewith ſtoppe v ſo fooliſhe madde runne ruſhing agaynſt needeth pleade owne cace open mouth ſpeake one word looke howe many creature aboue beneath many witneſſes cōfound v vtterly doubt bolde ynough aduaunce ourſelues againſt god though woulde plucke ſeate blaſphemies wee beare ourſelues hand may preuayle ourboldneſſe hath ſtoppes ynough caſt wayes nother beaſt earth bird ayre ſhal beare witneſſe agaynſte v vvee ſee god cace ſhall bee pleaded creature troubling himſelfe yet notwithſtanding wee ſhall haue deuized agaynſte muſte returne vpon owne head nowe although leſſon eaſie ynough yet ill minded men behalfe proofe heereof wee ſee foules flye ayre wee ſee beaſtes go vpon grounde yet howe fewe v wake vp thinke vpon god dayly haue ſtore temptation diuell breatheth v ſpirite grudging hartburning agaynſt god wee handled owne liking wee fall carping wrangling ſaying aware ſhewed doone heere vvee graunt well ynough thing vtterly apparante yet notwithſtanding wee forget neuer commeth minde againe eaſier commoner leſſon leſſe excuſe ſhal v blamewoorthie ſhall god minding thing ought haue knowne vnſpoken without putting remembrance ought vnderſtoode euery one v wee thinke vpon god diuell commeth pricke v ſo againſt letteth v owne malice vnthankfulneſſe seing ſo ſlowe thing ought bee euer readieſt v come minde ought ſo much marke touched euery man ſhoulde furniſh himſelfe aforehand ſuch warning looke mee vpon haukes flye ayre ſtraunge thing onely ſee liuing creature caſte forth ſelfe mount vp ſuche force ſeemeth ſhoulde pearce clowdes doubt would exceedingly abaſhed accuſtomed ſurmyze ſame done haphazard vvere poſsible birdes mounte vp faſhion god giuen nature nowe ſee god hande apparant birde v ſhall take vpō teach god leſſon cōfounded ſmall thing proportionableneſſe nereneſſe ſhall make cōpariſon betwene god creature agayne cōpare hawke reſidue whole worlde nothing ſo ſmall portion god work ought rauiſh v amaze v ought workes come full numbring ſo fall diſcourſing thing whiche wee ſee aboue beneath moreouer wee conſider maieſtie god yet hygher aboue al heauens ſo farre v wee cannot reache vnto dooth become v ſtoupe honour reuerence bee reſtreyned paſsing whenſoeuer diuell ſhall labour make v carpe agaynſt grudge manner meane thing ſpoken heere concerning nature eagle maye bee takē yong one ſucke bloud anone bee vnclozed bycauſe one kinde eagle doo caſte yong one neſte ſo bee driuen ſhifte themſelues ſayde bring vp none blacke one howbeeit wryte ſuch matter varie poynte ſome ſaye eagle caſt away yōg one baſtard eagle ſight ſtrong ynough looke full vpon ſhining sunne wee haue curious poynts philoſophers ynough v god doth ſhew v nature eagle ſuch wiſe knowne vſeth ye would ſay groſſe faſhion intent ſhoulde haue cloke excuſe ignorance looke mee vpon eagle bredde pray yea euen ſhell haue propertie ſucking bloude ſtraunge thing birde ſhoulde ſo feede nouriſhe ſelfe bloude beholde crueltie put intoo needes therefore muſte haue nature giuen another whence commeth diuerſitie betweene birdes liue pray foules muſte difference bee god putting thereby ſheweth v ſuche ſignes prouidence wee forced cōfeſſe gouerneth ordereth al thing birdes made owne body ſo alſo gaue thēſelues inclination haue ſame commeth elſwhere god ſheweth himſelfe ſuch wiſe muſt nedes woorſhip maieſtie thus ye ſee chiefe poynt haue remember text therfore man needeth go ſchoole matter let open eye meene euen verieſt idiot thing ſhewed v knowne men therefore muſte needes condemned ſo brutiſhe blockiſh know thing vtterly apparant ſpecially ſeing added eagle reſort thither perceyue dead body bee ſmell dead carkeſſes farre ſpie pray make theyr flight thitherward nowe ſee ſuch thing lette v vnderſtand lord hath put ſecrete mouing impoſsible eagle ſhould haue themſelues g • hath inured imprinted wote thing whereby hee ſheweth himſelfe wōderful looke v behold diuerſitie work inforced ſpite teeth know creator maker beareth ſway beaſtes one nature inclination god prouidence ſhoulde darkeſome likelihood ſeemeth bee ſayde nature beareth ſway according ſee whē philoſophers themſelues ſearched conſidered thing throughout ſteade worſhipping magnifiyng god workes bent witte vnderſtanding forge nature ſhould ſerue deface god glory therein diuell ruled great horrible damnation ſee ſuche varietie one birde one nature another another beaſts alſo differ cānot ſayd one nature might liuing thing went one line men ſawe one anſwerable conformitie beaſts thing ſo diſpozed men woulde ſaye nature nature would neuer thinke vpon god ſith ſee one birde hath fearefulneſſe another hath therein god working appeereth better dooues ſee fearefull foules contrarywiſe wee ſee goſſehawkes birdes pray hardie againe foules greate whiche yet notwithſtanding giue themſelues praye example looke vpon swannes wyll feede vppon carion byrdes pray eagle seing commeth ſuch diuerſitie eye god doeth therein ſhewe v prouidence apparantly ſo much conuicted thing well woorthye bee marked without going men one countenance woman likewyſe ſo one ſtature one colour one making one looke one minde ſhould ſo well know creator ſhaped v hee dealeth forth grace giftes holy ſpirite ſuch meaſure pleaſeth would ſeeme mother wombe ſhaped v ſeede oure father gaue v ſubſtance ſhape euer wee haue ſhort men would thinke themſelues beholding god thing yeelde honor ſee ſuch diuerſitie men ſo one bigge another ſmall diſpoſitions differ ſo one ſharpewitted another dull one great eloquence vtterance ſpeache another good halfe dumbe wee ſee theſe thing muſte wee needes wee bee malicious frowarde confeſſe god owne pleaſure diſtributeth vnto v gyftes holie ſpirite hath made v faſhioned v according wee haue ſeene heeretofore like woman hath mylked hir kyne ſhee maketh hir cheeſe faſhion ſhee hir ſelfe lyſteth ſo god alſo diſpozeth v ſuche wiſe wee wote ſaye hys hande woorketh yea euen marueylous faſhion therefore lette v learne bee blinde ſuche diuerſitie thing god ſetteth afore v whenſoeuer open eye ſo many thing come ſight ſo one mā hath ſhape another hath another cleane contrary lette v vnderſtande god draweth v himſelfe foraſmuch ſeeth v ſlow comming cheereth v vp pricketh v foreward ſo maner forced go onward except malicious ſtubbornneſſe withſtande carpe ſaying ſee ſee yet another poynt ſayd eagle gather togither place caryons wit ſith bird liue pray haue skill ſeeke feeding ſpeciallye eagle doo ſmell farre aught feede vpon much reaſon wee ſhoulde reſort place god ſheweth v life therfore ſeeing birdes reſort togither corruptible foode yea runne thither take payne excuſe v wee ſide refuze ſpirituall foode offered v haue wit reſort place life shall neede witneſſes againſt v eagle according alſo lord ieſus ſetteth foorth ſame ſimilitude vnto v hath ſpoken greate trouble ſhoulde bee worlde ſayeth whereſoeuer deade carkeſſe thyther wyll eagle reſorte according wherevntoo wee countrie may ſay lyke rauens yee ſee theſe poore byrdes haue naturall inclination ſeeke meate pray ſhall ſide finde life shoulde wee bee ſo witleſſe lord ieſus chriſt calleth allureth v vnto telling v wee come thither wee ſhall finde want bee inriched maner good thing ſo ſhal fully repleniſhed nurriſhment ſtrength euen full contentation therefore let v thinke vpon ſeeing haue ſuch aſſurance muſte eagle beare witneſſe againſt v great day retchleſſe let v come back principall poynt touched beginning according alſo god concludeth ſame namely learning contend almightie lette correcteth god anſwere ſerueth ſhewe v purpoſe ſo many thing haue bene diſcourſed man might thinke ſtraunge god intēding mainteine rightuouſneſſe ſtoppe men mouthes ſhould carpe agaynſt ſhold ſpeake ſtarres tilling grounde maner ſayling ſet foorth nature beaſts purpoſe ſhoulde ſeeme god ſeeketh rouing reaſons yea wee ſhall haue conſidered poynt touched wee ſhall finde muche auaylable v hee maynteyneth rightuouſneſſe manner hee diſputed without ſetting creature afore v wee muſte come backe concluſion although hee ſhoulde let v alone babbling yet ſhoulde wee winne nothing wee coulde crye ſo lowde beate eares hee coulde ſet many ſtoppes waye looke howe many creature heauen earth ſea ſhould riſe vp bend themſelues agaynſt v ſo wee ſhoulde bee able come nigh god nowe ſee manner dealing whiche god vſeth daunt iob perſon ſuche impacient needes aduaunce themſelues high fit may could haue taken better way teach hath hilde heretofore cauſe ſayde behoueth v marke well concluſion doth ſhewe himſelfe bee wiſe contendeth almightie true foraſmuche hebrew woorde ſette downe heere ſignifieth well teach correct woorde woorde thus learning correcting ſtriue almightie might taken though ſayde doeth man ſo quarelleth ſtriueth god prepare himſelfe bee chaſtyzed contrariwiſe hardeneth himſelfe nowe true wiſedome haue skill chaſtize ſelues knowe want may ſory aſhamed haue none helpe pray god receyue v mercy pitie v true wiſdome men muſt conclude contrary part ſuch ſo lift vp themſelues agaynſte god ſtarke fooles meening come alwayes poynt ſo diuerſitie matter doctrine wil tende alwayes one marke namely men onely miſaduiſed alſo vtterly deſtitute witte reaſon take ſo vpon plead againſt theyr maker better vnderſtanding heereof let v holde theſe twoo degree haue ſpoken let firſt true wiſdome ouermaiſter oure ſelues long man ſtandeth owne conceyte looketh loftily ouer ſconreful hee dooth nothing throwe himſelfe headlong intoo decay ende cannot bee deadly therefore nothing better v correct amende ourſelues ſay beate downe ſelues ſuch wiſe god may weelde v acknowledge bee nothing wee bee ſo full wretchedneſſe hee muſte bee fayne gouerne v take ſelues bee beholding good thing agayne ſecond poynt ſeeing needie vnfurniſhed deſtitute thing lette v runne vnto welſping power wiſedome rightuouſneſſe ſhorte let v vnderſtande whome holde life appurtenance thereof yee ſee way well taught learned aſhamed ſelues flee vnto god therwithal condemne wicked deedes ſinnes acknowledge oure nature nothing frowardneſſe corruption vvhen haue learned hate ſelues maner ſure wee haue greatly profited nowe man amende himſelfe intendeth plead againſt god surely euen good draught poyſon make v mad diuell bring v poynte take pritche againſt god diſcontented accuſe wrong take diſpleaſure ſhould handle v otherwiſe ourſelues woulde haue ſay diuell putteth furiouſneſſe heades ſo become ſtarke madde awke thing v chaſtiſe ourſelues ſuch chafe chawe vpon brydle although god afflict v yet notwithſtanding ſteade humbling ourſelues ceaſſe fire againſt therfore teaching v ſay ſeeking true good learning nother right wiſdome ſtande ſo contention god lo heere poynt cō prehendeth much skill put vreas ſhould foraſmuch ſo giuen toyes ſo wilfull withall god addeth take vpon v correct muſt anſwere ſay thing hath alledged afore v true ſome reſtreyne ſaying verſe muſt anſwere wee pleade agaynſt god correct foraſmuch ſee cannot bee altogither apparant muſte therefore conclude wee haue cauſe pleade bee throughly conſidered certaine god ment make heere generall concluſion matter hee diſcourſed heertoofore let v marke wee wyll correct ſelues willingly yea euen vtter abſteyning murmuring ſo keepe mouthes ſhet go finde fault god meanes muſte bee inforced come wee haue pleaded fill god hath ynough wherewith reuenge himſelfe fooliſhe attemptes hee wyll arme creature hee ſhall haue many aduocates proctours law agaynſt v bird ayre fiſhes ſea beaſtes lande ſhorte man needeth go himſelfe bee diſproued ſee woonderfull woorkemanſhip god euery tip finger endes oure nayles witneſſeth god ſo excellēt workemaiſter ought cōfoūded oft thinke vpō leaſt thing ſheweth v haue true naturall meening ſentence ſayd let reproueth almightie anſwere howbeit behoueth v mark howe profitable doctrine v true v firſt ſight ſay lewde heynous dealing go reproue god meane forbeareth vve wil well make coūtenāce haue modeſtie yet none v hee ſtarkleth god hande bee thing rough v thing fall oure liking whome ſuch ſtarklings puſh thought affliction came v god hande trouble whiche ſeene worlde iudgements proceede euen good perſecuted wicked beare ſwaye wyl exerciſe pacience meanes clenze v vanity ſhort mortifie v worldwarde ſay wiſt offended ſee church hath peace reſte good men troden vnder foote vexed ſo one pinched ſickneſſe another pouertie meane wicked haue ful ſcope free ſuche inconueniences ſay wee knewe wee woulde learne humble ſelues contrariwiſe ſo ranckle inwardly cannot hold ourſelues murmuring againſt god though euē within teeth pray accuſe god crueltie though reaſon handle v manner vvee open mouth ſaye god cruell vniuſt truely ſay ſo yet tende ende ſee leſſon belongeth men namely take vpon v reprooue god finde fault muſt anſwere workes nowe let v apply wittes let euery v hee yet wee haue debated vpon thing afore rehearſed pray poſsible v anſwere thē reply vnto god thing hath done diſpoſed nature creation thing doubte ſhall finde ſtore ynough follie ſelues according ſee howe men ouerſhoote themſelues diuell alſo blindeth ſuch wiſe ſticke carpe maker behooueth v come pithe wee ſay gayneſay order nature ſettled wee denye prouidence god aboliſhe power ſheweth ſelfe cā ſay hath diſpoſed al thing wiſedome agayne wee diſplace iuſtice whiche appeareth v matched goodneſſe wiſedome wee bryng theſe thing paſſe impoſsible nowe muſte men needes bee blockiſhe wyll aduaunce themſelues maner agaynſt theyr maker done intent may fare better doctrine muſte beginne ende namely feele howe weake wee anſwere thing god put v seing wee bee able furniſhe ſelues lette v learne humble oure ſelues ſorte lette v runne foreſayde wiſedome correct ſelues therfore men haue looked well themſelues conſidered want cauſe ſtande vppon theyr owne reputation ſooth themſelues beare thēſelues hande able ſhall fayne fall thēſelues bee aſhamed theyr owne filthineſſe hate abhorre themſelues ſo mortified ſhall behooue offer god ſacrifyze ſpoken pſalme witte ſacrifize broken hearte vvhen wee bee come poynte true wiſedome lette deſpyzers god ruffle lette fling abroade randon muche lyſt worke theyr owne miſcheefe ende mounting vp muſte tumble downe agayne lette v bee ſure humbling ſelues ſhall haue good foundation ſtay ſhall vphilde grace oure god thus ſee wiſedome power god whiche houeth v magnifie reſpect creature ſith maketh v inioy ſo many benefites worlde alſo ye ſee wiſedome looking vpward downward behold diuerſities creature hee ſheweth v wee muſt alwayes reſort vnto certified prouidence ſeing hee hath graunted v grace call v vnto lette v learne come quietly vnder hand lette gouerne v pleaſure meane time hee handle v faſhion ſeemeth hard comberſome v lette v take paciently pray comfort v ſtrengthen v ſuch wyſe loue howſoeuer fare maynot time go murmur againſt nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying may ſo touched thē may throughly beate v downe make v flee onely mercie onely remedie v hee onely forgiue ſinnes paſt alſo gouerne v ſuch wiſe holy ſpirite hencefoorth oure whole deſire may bee walke obedience ſo let v ſaye almightie god heauenly father c cliiij sermon fourth vpon xxxix chapter first vpon xl chapter 36 iob anſvvering lorde ſayde 37 bace degree vvhat ſhall anſvverc thee vill lay hande vpon mouth 38 haue ſpoken vvill anſvvere yea tvvice vvill turne againe xl chapter lorde ſpeaking vvhirlevvinde ſayde vnto iob 2 gyrde vp thy loynes like valiant man aske mee vvill make thee vnderſtand 3 vvilt thou diſanull iudgement vvilt thou condemne mee iuſtifie thy ſelfe 4 haſt thou arme like god thundereſt thou vvith ſuch voyce 5 cloth thy ſelfe vvith glory maieſtie excellent put thy coſtly apparrell 6 spread indignation thy vvrath looke vpon proude bring dovvne haue ſeene alredy god teach iob ryght humilitie ſpake whirle wind although onely voyce ought ynough aſtoniſh v yet notwithſtanding thereby hee ſheweth yet better howe harde fayne vſe ſome meanes abate pryde elſe ſhould bring true humilitie proceedeth god ſpirite ſuche ſtubbornly bent vnto naughtineſſe doo neuer ſubmitte themſelues willingly vntoo though hee gyue ſufficient warning experience leade dryue therevnto yet god vſing ſame violent meanes towardes thoſe whome gouerneth holy ſpirite intendeth therby ſhew v lewdneſſe frowardneſſe nature conſidering fayne thunder rore elſe continue blockiſh ſtill ſo perceyue maieſtie power ſubmit ſelues vnto nowe ſhewed v frute thing god hath done wheras ſayeth iob graunted himſelfe bace ſtate behoued hold peace keepe mouth ſhet therein appeareth god magnified himſelfe vayne ſpeaking ſo vvhirlewind without effect • iob tamed little lambe goeth aboute replie heretofore ſtriued taken vpon contend god mainteyning owne cace geere layde water ſayeth dare ſpeake whereas gone farre forward matter leaueth forbeareth vtterly lette v learne god thunder vehemently againſt v welfare although thinke rough firſt ſight god ſay muſt faine ſcare v ſide dull vpon spurre eaſie bee brought ſubiection therefore wee haue neede greate violence abate pryde v nature howbeeit let v marke alſo heerewithall god ſhall haue ſpoken ſo whirlewinde excuſe v wee followe iobs example acknowledging wretchedneſſe v end become altogither quiet poynt woorthie bee noted ſee dayly howe ſharpe rough god ende ouermayſter men bring home yet bee neuer better god touche one ſickneſſe chaſtize another pouertie one hee ſpake oute whirlewinde yea doth rappe v mayne blowes vpon heades yet verie fewe v doo amende vvee ſhall ſee ſome gnaſhe theyr teeth ſome fal furious rage rayling otherſome become wilful hardhearted ſo god ſhall mooue iobs example wyll condemne ſuche bluntneſſe ſturdineſſe although iob impacient caryed away ſome pang yet ende gaue eare roring voyce god whirlewinde ſtrake ſuche feare corrected himſelfe hilde peace euen ſo muſt therefore let v bethinke ſelues come conformitie god hath bene boyſteous towards v ſcared v continue wilde beaſts ſtill ſurely ſhal paye deere although wee haue ouerſhotte ourſelues yet let v ſtād cānot yeld ourſelues vnto god firſt blow yet leaſtwiſe let v beware wilfull whē ſee preſſeth v compelleth v maner force obediēt god vſe ordinary meanes let v reſiſt hope wee gaine ende muſt ſunken vnder hand thus ye ſee haue marke firſte place heerewithall let v learne beare paciently ſtripes god giueth v aſſuring ſelues meane whereby intendeth make v ready ſubiect vnto aſmuch good v wilde beaſts ſhould make v become ſheepe lambes let v take ſuch preparatine heart iobs example let v ſay lord ſee bace ſtate truely ſhould ſeeme ſaying caryeth great pith conſider well fooliſh ouerweening men wee ſhal ſee iob profited greatly could ſay bace ſtate bee demaunded whence come anſwere wretched creature taken earth ſo frayle pitie ſee fraught ſtore infirmity vve wyll confeſſe theſe thing mouth yet meane whyle wil ceaſſe eſteeme ſelues forget whence came whither wee muſte return preſente ſtate none commeth minde men yee woulde ſaye drunken bearing thēſelues hand much worth chalenge worthineſſe fantaſticall imagination therefore whenſoeuer man dooth truely vnfeynedly knowe howe deſpyze himſelfe hee hath aught wherefore ſhoulde aduaunce himſelfe muche yea great wiſedome let v marke well ſhall neuer come ſuche reaſon till wee throughly touched maieſtie glorie god ſo long men looke one vppon another take occaſion eſteeme themſelues ſaying well bee liked compariſon men make one another blindeth maketh thinke alwayes bee wote come vnto god ſheweth himſelfe ouerweening muſte fayne vaniſh away diſperſe come nothing ſo wee haue beſeeche god make v perceyue glory ende wee may enter ſayde examination oure owne wretchedneſſe diſable ourſelues ſuch wiſe none v may beguile himſelfe owne fooliſh imagination alſo cauſe abrahā god appeared ſayde ala duſt aſhes vve wel ynough ſay ſo maner v though god far minde wee thinke howbeit hypocriſie feynedneſſe neuer hartily earneſtly till wee haue felt god therfore let v marke well order ſet downe god hath ſpoken iob whirlewinde iob confeſſeth himſelfe nothing ought ſo bold ſpeke one way howbeit let v bethinke v well alſo whenſoeuer god ſo fauorable appeare v wee muſte ſo fooliſh make account ourſelues vertues maruell thoughe wretched papiſts imagine freewill ground obteyning paradiſe vppon men owne merites weening make god detter neuer acquainted light goſpell bewrayeth men wantes inaſmuche god vttereth owne rightuouſneſſe theſe ſily ſoules neuer hauing felt power god abuſe themſelues ſuche deceytes v ſeeing god telleth v perfect rightuouſneſſe therwithall diſcouereth filthineſſe ſheweth v nothing abhomination v muſt tyed ſuch dotage vtterly diſable ſelues pryde may bee beaten downe v oure god bee glorified thoſe therfore haue bin taught purely goſpell muſt come poynte wiſedome vtter diſabling themſelues cauſe wee ſay fayth bringeth men loftineſſe god reuealeth goodneſſe vnto v ſo muſt aſſure ſelues dooing ſo bycauſe nothing curſedneſſe v ſhould vtterly vndone forlorne vouchſafeth ſuccour v mercie ſo doctrine goſpell bringeth v meeldneſſe vtter abacing diſabling ourſelues al thing herewithall iob ſayth lay hand vpon mouth whereas hee hath ſpoken hee fall agayne whereas hee hath ſpoken twice hee ſo vvheras ſayeth lay hande vpon mouth ſigne proteſtation proceede manner ſpeeche rife ſcripture ſerueth v vnderſtand muſt reſtreine fooliſh appetite fleſhe tickleth v ſpeake wee muſte reſiſt putting muzzle bridle vppon mouthes refreyne man ſo wiſe himſelfe woulde tempted ſpeake amiſſe hee ſhoulde neede laye hande vpon mouth hee woulde refrayne owne accorde ſhoulde neede neyther ſtoppe barre nowe contrarie parte whereas ſayde muſt lay hande vpon mouth v wit haue fight agaynſt fonde luſtes liking continually make v haſty ſpeaking inſomuche tongue ſhall ſtill ſharpe ſette caſte forth ſome thing nought woorth agaynſt god heere wee warned vice great wicked hurtfull needes ſharpe witted pleading agaynſte god ſet foorth ourſelues brauerie ende cloke wantes vayne excuſes ye ſee thing whervnto mē tend wholy inclined woulde fayne cloke themſelues hypocriſie rather condemne god ſuffer themſelues bee brought reaſon ſo alwayes haue ſome lye ſtartinghole yea ende fall ſpewing oute blaſphemies tongue venemous altoogither ſoked lying falſehoode laſte burſteth euen againſt god sith know haue good cauſe miſlyke ſelues therefore whenſoeuer heare maner ſpeeche holy men layde theyr hande vpon mouth let v remember howe forwarde wee bee ſpeake amiſſe ſpecially wee compare ſelues iob hee could holde peace without ſtreyning himſelfe ala ſhall wee come farre ſhorte profiting ſo much ye ſee touching firſt poynt men ought alwayes miſtruſte themſelues whē haue occaſion ſpeake knowing wel nature doth continually prouoke thē ſpeake emiſſe tung nothing elſe warehouſe leaſing hipocriſie end appeareth nothing poyſon according ſayde pſalme poyſon aſpe • vnder tung thoſe vnreformed vntil ſuch time god hath made cleane mouthes skill vtter nothing curſedneſſe bitterneſſe therefore let v learne hereby refrayne ſelues euen hatred towarde euill haue bene much accuſtomed frame ſelues meeldneſſe obedientneſſe ſhewed v holy ghoſt inaſmuchas ſo forward ſpeake amiſſe ſtandeth v hand indeuer amende ſuche faultineſſe doubt ynough haue acknowledged haue cō demned behoueth v alſo redreſſe iob lay hand vpon mouth haue holy prophetes doone muche lette v followe ſo dooing witte whenſoeuer prouoked grudge agaynſt god though haue neuer ſo fine ſhifts diſguyſe truth turne lye let v reſiſt ſuche lewdneſſe fight agaynſte ſuche vngraciouſneſſe ſeeing ſo vntowarde condemned god ſhall laying hande vpon mouth ſay putting ſtop owne way behooueth v brydle ſelues wilde beaſtes therefore let euery man looke neerely himſelfe happen afflicted croſſed ſome ouerthwart thing ſo one v fretteth another chafeth thirde ſo ranckled poyſon bee prouoked ſpeake amiſſe let v reſtreyne ourſelues good wee ſo wyll ſome man ſay finde verie hard mee alwayes incline ſyde yea ynough reſ 〈…〉 againſt woorthie condemned though ouercome imagination conceyuing thought wicked ſinfull god infinite goodneſſe taketh good worth whē ſeeth euill liketh v labour repreſſe god perceyuing v haue inclination fay leth accept v vvherefore ſeeing ſo gracious towardes v wee ought haue ſo muche courage ſtoppe wicked wordes blaſphemies moylings might bruſte agaynſte god ſayde iob hauing ſpoken leaueth yea ſeeing hee ſpoken tw •• e would ſo vvhereby betokeneth firſt haue gone farre ſpeaking amiſſe muſt therefore harden ſelues ſee many haue ouerſhotte themſelues raunged farre ſquare bee brought backe againe play double quit ſay vve muſte ſo although euill continuance wee haue followed farre alreadie yet muſte turne heade ſo ſoone god warneth v therefore let men play bedlems haue done amiſſe long time togither doubled euill haue caſt forth fooliſhe woorde vnaduiſedly clapped twoo three mo necke let therefore grow ſpitefull agaynſt god let condemne themſelues double treble therevpon returne agayne ryght waye thus yee ſee thing whiche wee haue marke ſtreyne although wee haue continued offende god long time neuer ſeaſon v turne new leafe ſecond poynt muſt ſ • atter ſelues though haue many occaſions ſee iob many fayre colour alledged ſome one reaſon alone mayntenaunce cace greate ſtore doubled proofes diuerſe ſortes inſomuche ſeemed haue matter ynough yee woulde haue ſayde hee beene fully perſwaded hee looked determinately haue gone away victorie hee ſooner ſet downe one article hee able haue come another yet notwithſtanding nowe hee giueth ouer replyes goodly likelyhoodes pleade againſt god vvhereas haue ſpoken twice ſayeth hee renounce euery whit ſo heereby wee bee taught ſayde although wee neuer ſo many fayre clokings thought ſelues haue verie good reaſons well grounded maynteyne cace bee nothing worth muſte fall grounde therefore let v flatter ourſelues fondneſſe ende muſt fayne come hath bene treated heeretofore namely god haue thouſande article one let v keepe v entering contention alſo let v ſtoutly withſtande fancy whiche diuell putteth heade go make v chafe agaynſt god hee tempte v ſet v fire grudging ſtubbornneſſe lette thruſt downe though whole hundredes replyes myght ſeeme fay • e good done ſayde god began yet againe ſpeake whirlewinde ſaying vnto iob gyrde vp thy loynes like man ſaying haue heard heretofore nowe man myght thinke ſtraunge god ſhoulde ſtill ſpeake terribly vnto iob defie mocke preſumptuouſneſſe ſeeing vtterly caſt downe himſelfe hereby mā may ſee humbled yet ſtil ſome remnant pryde hiddē v appeareth god muſt fayne purge v certaine iob confeſſed himſelfe bee wretched creature man value vſed feinednes ſpake hart gaue yet ſee fully tamed come meeke humble minde deſiring bee wholy obedient vnto god yet needed chaſtized ſtill bee better ſchooled ende might acknowledge himſelfe therevpon yeelde glory prayſe vnto god ſo bicauſe ſayde alwayes ſome backenooke although men brought vnto god deſirous frame themſelues god wyll yet throughly clenzed pryde firſte god perceyueth ſtill ſome ſecrete diſeaſe behind behoueth amende lo heere notable text haue wee ſlightly conſeſſed god afflicting v rightfull acknowledged ſinnes wee woonder hee ſhoulde go forwarde ſtill handling v roughly make v ſay howe ought god ſo rigorous towardes mee hee knoweth haue humbled ſelfe whereas haue done amiſſe haue acknowledged faultes yea euen faultes conſeſſe accuſe ſelfe ynough vvhat woulde hee haue ſeemeth v god ſort doth v wrong hee ſtryke v ſtyll wee haue woorde twayne confeſſed ſelues ſinners yea lette v looke iob hee onely confeſſed himſelfe bee man value alſo thought hys hearte reſtreyned himſelfe replying ſtriken feare glory god appeared vnto yet notwithſtanding needed ſtyll haue god thunder ſhewe himſelfe terrible whirlewinde make afrayde iob hauing bin throwne downe ſorte neede bee put feare ſtyll ende hee myghte knowe himſelfe better ſee owne wretchedneſſe forget rebelliouſneſſe ala nede yet notwithſtanding ye ſhall ſee number haue nothing hypocriſie yea ſhameleſneſſe wring theyr mouth aſide ſay true haue doone amiſſe haue ſaid word way ſcorne mockerie men accept poſthaſt rightuous handle nicely ſecmeth thē bee vnreaſonably dealte ſayde afore although wee haue felte ſinnes yea euen earneſtly confeſſed withoute feygning deſired hartely god ſhoulde gouerne v haue dominion ouer v yet dooth followe ſome naughtineſſe lurking ſtyll behinde thoughe bee knowne of▪ truely owne ſeeming pride v bycauſe ſee preſently within day twoo woulde bee ſeene god remedied therefore let v thinke ſtraunge god ſhoulde ſpeake vnto v whirlewinde thunder euen ſhall haue ſcourged v till let v woonder though god continue ſpeake vntoo v ſo hee knoweth good cauſe although perceyue fault v yet let v ceaſe condemne ſelues yea although none v preſently ▪ ▪ yet doth god knowe might fall day morrow yea euen euerie minute houre therefore god chaſtizing v vſeth preſeruatiue medicine vvherefore let v beare paciently affliction god ſendeth v aſſuring ſelues meanes procureth furthereth welfare nowe let v come matter god handleth firſt defieth iob ſaying girde vp thy loynes like luſtie ſtoute follow true hebrew one worde man howbeit ſame importeth much valiant hardie ſtoute couragious man meening shewe thy valiantneſſe therein ſee god ſpeaketh perſon iob alſo mankinde without exception ſhoulde ſay let men bring force let put themſelues good aray liſt let come furniture ſhall gaine agaynſt mee therefore defiance god maketh great ſmall ſhewe cannot bring power ſhall bee able match firſt poynt howbeeit ſeemeth verie commonly knowne man hee woulde bee adrad take vppon matche himſelfe god demaunded whether intent mount ſo highe diſpoſſeſſe god ſuperioritie ouer woulde anſwere trowe wee worſe madde yet notwithſtanding carping agaynſt wee wee iuſtifie ſelues excuze faultes ſpyting god warning agaynſt therefore wee enter ſo intoo battell wee beare ſelues hande wee able make part good according verie deede man bee afrayde god maieſtie hee preſume compaſſe thing taketh hand meanes bee hilde backe raſhneſſe doo carie v ſo farre away fight agaynſt god token wee imagine great power ſelues therfore without cauſe doth god defie v heere eueriechone v greate ſmall ſhewing madneſſe v bid battell ſort wee ſhall neuer bring enterpriſe let v marke well god ſayth girde vp thy loynes like man therein declareth▪ preſuming ſo vpon owne ſtrengthes purpoſe vvhat maketh v ſo bolde preſume bee rightuous deſire ſeeme wiſe wee ſurmyze thing wee ouertaken wyth fonde opinion ſome valour v wee woulde neuer bee ſo bold incounter faſhion god therfore expreſſe mention made men power ſtrength end ſhewe weene themſelues haue ſmoke may well make thēſelues beleue ſtrong yet god knoweth taketh bee herewithall ſheweth haue counterfeyt humilitie wee ſee woont many men lie pretende humilitie god ſay confeſſe thing mouth thinke hart among papiſts much preaching humilitie yet al ſaying wretched ſinners ceaſſe haue cleane contrarie meaning whiche deſerue well god although bee ſinners yet haue ſatiſfactions redeeme themſelues yee ſee papiſtes ſwolne pryde lyke toades yet meanewhile pretende condemne themſelues alwayes guiltie god yea number euen among v full fraught maner pride bee ſhort men cannot ſhewe fignes humility way mockage bycauſe beleeue themſelues ſome valour cauſe god declareth heere wee haue throughly tryed owne ſtrength well conſidered v ſhall finde ende nothing v arme apparell ſelues encounter agaynſt yee ſee thing wee haue marke effect lord bereueth v thing haue ende haue aduauntage v wee haue well looked v let v onely conſider maner one ſhall well ſee ther neither power ſtrength v wherewith bende ſelues agaynſt vvhereas mention made girding vp loynes ſpoken maner time countrey alſo bycauſe men went long garment ſet foorth eyther battel iourney girded vp loynes weld themſelues better god ſheweth men haue done al end ſhalbe cō founded therfore let v attempt vaunt ourſelues ſhall alwayes argue fooliſh pride v let v win ſpurs condemning ſelues onely meane v get fauour god ſight according ſayde ſhall bee quitte hand learne condemne ſelues pride fall iuſtling againſt hand ſtrōg v wee muſte needes bee cruſhed broken peeces vnder feele heauie load v beare nowe ſayde vvilt thou ouerthrowe iudgements condemne iustifie thy ſelfe thou intende ſo ſee first thou beeſt able beate downe proude folke worlde heere god entereth cace hee hath pleade agaynſt iob wit whether ſhall bee rightuous iobs intent blaſpheme god ſo lewdly haue ſayde afore hee woulde rather haue dyed hundred thouſande time haue conceyued ſo curſed thought purpoſe condemne god yet al ſoeuer man iuſtifie himſelfe hath imagination running head muſt need condemne god needes mainteyne owne cace hee muſt needes ouerthrowe iudgement god matter hath bene layde forth afore neuertheleſſe muſt needes brought remembrance againe ſuperfluous repetition holy ghoſt ſetteth downe therefore let v marke well whenſoeuer man vndertaketh mainteyne owne cace rightfull hys meening cōdemne god howbeit directly although intend ſet purpoſe hart yet doth effect vvhy ſo god cannot beiuſt iudge alſo vntill damnable long men haue rightuouſneſſe themſelues ſhall god iudge hee condemneth v bee rightuouſneſſe v dooth hee v wrong therfore muſt owne rightuouſneſſe caſt ſay wee muſt acknowledge nothing iniquitie v haue one ſparke vertue v allowable ſtarke filthineſſe dung infection till wee bee come poynt▪ god cannot bee iudge worlde therefore whoſoeuer mainteyne owne quarell make himſelfe men beleeue pure innocent ouerthroweth god iudgement vttermoſt power therewithall condemneth cruell ſayde ende god may bee rightuous mouthes muſte bee ſtopped worlde confeſſe themſelues indaungered vntoo god thoſe sainct paules wordes thirde romanes sith ſo contrarie part ſhall bee rightuouſneſſe god hee ſhall bee vtterly defeated wee ſyde haue mouthes open ſo wee may come replie agaynſt pleade owne cace vvee ſee naught ſayde heere vntoo iob hee ment ouerthrowe god iudgement condemne iuſtifying himſelfe nowē befell vnto iob angelicall holineſſe alwayes euen middes temptation proteſt himſelfe willing giue glorie vntoo god yea gaue without feyning ala ſhall become v ſo frayle haue beene trayned long aforehande feare god hee haue wee practiſe haue wee giuen ſelues haue wee ſuch knowledge giuen vnto haue wee ſuch humilitie ala farre wide yet notwithſtanding wee ſee hee ouerſhotte himſelf yea euen ſo farre condemne god cleering himſelfe let v conſider murmuring god layeth affliction vpon v howe go wee woorke like woode beaſtes paſsions ſo headie pitie ſee therefore may rightly layde charge labour ouerthrowe god iuſtice intent might bee iudge worlde wee condemne going aboute mainteyne owne rightuouſneſſe ought teach v well holde ſelues ſhort oft intende pleade agaynſt god thinke ſelues haue good cace ought make v ſay thus harte ala ſhoulde fall exalting ſelfe agaynſt hath made faſhioned mee ſhoulde intende rob rightuouſneſſe cannot god hath perfection rightuouſneſſe himſelfe therefore ouerſhoot ſelfe ſort ſtriuing agaynſt muſt hee confounde muſt ſame needes turne deſtruction lo ought holde v awe therfore whenſoeuer happen grudge agaynſt god cannot receyue affliction hande let v enter owne minde conſider ſelues one wee woulde bereeue god rightuouſneſſe put beeing iudge worlde ſeeing ſo let v keepe ſelues ſuch blaſphemies abhorre come vntoo knowing wee bee entered intoo deepe dungeon whereout hard v get againe let v lift vp ſelues agaynſt god rather let v caces humble ſelues lo ought reſidue ſhall reſerued till morow morning nowe let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying make v feele better haue hitherto done may learne glorifie yea euē ſuch wiſe may vtterly throwne downe knowing nothing wickedneſſe curſedneſſe v glorifying wee ſide may haue mouthes ſhette reſpect preſuming thing caried away example proude thinke themſelues beare much rule god learne knowe wee bee ende may yeelde ſelues wholly ſubiect maieſtie meanes may acknowledge v auow v people part conſider howe much bound vnto may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c clv sermon ſecond vpon xl chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon 4 5 6 verſes vpon text added 7 caſt thine eye vpon loftie pull dovvne deſtroy vvicked raſe place 8 hyde duſt binde face darkneſſe 9 vvill ſay thine ovvne hande ſaue thee 10 looke vpon bemoth vvhom made vvith thee vvill eate hay oxe 11 ſtrength loynes force nauill bellie 12 ſetteth vp tayle ceder ſinevves coddes interlaced togither 13 bone braſſe ſmall bone barres yron▪ 14 beginning god vvayes made caſteth ſvvorde agaynſt 15 mountaynes bring forth graſſe beaſtes feeld play 16 keepeth among reedes moyſt place 17 ſhadovves ſhall couer vvillovves riuer hide 18 beholde hee drinketh vp riuers aſtoniſhed hopeth iordan ſhall paſſe throte 19 man vvill take noſe vvith hooke ſtrike wee ſawe yeſterday men chafe frette aduerſities go lawe god intending condemne iuſtifying themſelues although man ſpeake mouth yet verie deede hee go cleere himſelfe hee condemneth god ſhall haue better ende ſtaffe cauſe ſayde haue layde ſtrength togither ſhall nothing neither ſhall euer bee able match hath created v holdeth thing hande ſhewed vnto v bee reſpect god ende make v lay away crowing good ſooth looking men ſtate conſidering therewithall glorie maieſtie god thing ſhould bring vnto lowlineſſe men looke ſingly vpon themſelues leaue preſume lift vp themſelues ſtill vnto ſome vaine truſt lift vp eye aloft behold god afterward come downe themſelues combes quite cutte therefore ſayde thine arme like arme god rorest thou ſuch voyce doth man looke vpōhis arme yea vpon force worlder ſhall find compariſon infinite power beareth ſway ouer true haue ſayde alreadie men fooliſh ynough think owne ſtrength great ſo long loke ſoone god ſhe weth himſelfe al thing muſt need brought nothing ende thing may touch v better iob willed cloth himſelfe glorie power maiestie ſame maner ſpeaketh scripture god thing ſelfe ſheweth elſe heauen thā imperiall kingly roabe god ſo bee inforced reuerentneſſe beholding creature thing ſerueth ſet foorth maieſtie god end ſhould honour becommeth v deſerueth nowe let v go ſeeke like apparellings ſhall either tayler make imbroyderer decke vvhere ſhall find ſuch ſtuffe may cloth ſelues like glorie god clothed nedes muſt men wittes ſo blinde forgetfull grudge god take part againſt prouoke againſt themſelues deſerue horrible condemnation ye ſee thing haue marke effect whereas mention made god arme haue expoſition howe god arme ſelfe inuiſible hath armes hand ſpeaking ſo meene whole god himſelfe vnknowne vnto v howbeeit hee ſheweth himſelfe woorkes inſomuch heauen ſayde garment sometime termed ſeate therewithall ſayd alſo viſible ſhape maieſtie much bee ſayde earth ſhort aboue beneath god ſheweth himſelfe v beeing ſayde afore thing able comprehende inſomuch witneſſe v infinite maieſtie god therefore let v learne although cannot attayne mount ſo high knowe god yet notwithſtanding foraſmuch leaueth v without witneſſe ſheweth himſelfe v much behoofe let v learne ſay beholde euen ereatures applie thing vſe namely wee may perceyue howe one god hathe made doth gouerne thing moreouer touching ſayde roring voyce true men crie loude according ſee whet tongue blaſpheme ſpyte god ſayde pſalme wicked think ynough bee proude among men accuſe one falſely defie another worke treaſons wicked practiſes alſo caſt vp groyne agaynſt heauen aſſault god himſelfe pride ſo great dare buskle agaynſt maieſtie god nowe yee ſee men rore yet god make holde peace well ynough hee liſt maner vvee haue ſeene heeretofore according alſo ſayde pſalme thunder god voyce ſith thunder maketh hilles rore ſo ayre ſort clouen aſunder earth quaketh tree torne vp rockes ſhaken ſay wee heare v ſhall preſume ſpeake agaynſt god hee hath voyce well ynough put v ſilence let v crie aloude full throte yet god bee heard ſpyte teeth moylings muſt fall grounde furthermore although god thunder ſuch faſhion yet muſt hee needes ſtoppe mouthes ſhewing v make outcryes layde downe needeth come downe heauen doo ſhewe himſelfe heere viſible ſhape like hee made thing woorde thing vphilde power thereof ſo hee by▪the ſame cauſe v folter tongue alſo wit al powers▪ god hath diuerſe maners ſpeaking wherby putte th mē ſo ſilence would carpe agaynſt ſhall haue audience therfore let v learne holde peace willingly put vr • yeſterdayes leſſon lay hande vpon mouth ſay reſiſt diueliſhnes pride notwithſtanding naturally bold aduance ſelues againſt god therwithall learne giue glorie ſimplie vnto god confeſsing nothing wretchedneſſe ſelues vvhen confounded owne good god voyce onely dreadful vnto v alſo wil cheere v vp open mouth may ſpeake freely vvherof cōmeth faithfull vaunt themſelues againſt diuell deſpiſe death vvherof commeth boldneſſe call vpon god father proteſt ſelues bee child bicauſe hild mouthes ſhet condemned haue learned wee bee nothing vanitie therfore haue mouthes ſhet ſort ſo chalenge thing ſelues ne maintein quarell paſſe vnder condemnation willingly god infinit goodneſſe giueth v libertie ſpeake onely among men alſo call vpon frankly doubting voyce caried vp throne angel heard accepted ye ſee thing gaine ſimplie holde peace graunt glorie belongeth vnto god diſable themſelues vtterly haue mouthes opened hath bin declared contrarywiſe talkatiue puffe vp themſelues pride maintein owne rightuouſneſſe muſt faine feele terrible god voice beſides let thē crie much liſt yet god ſpite teeth breake peeces ſhall cry ceaſſe vaniſh away ſhall bee done hee hath ouerterrible voyce nowe ſpeaking alſo another reaſon alledged humble men withall god defieth witte whether destroye proude looke whether roote wicked ſhew themſelues haue ſomewhat whereof boaſt cannot dare commence quarell agaynſt god heere ſtill ſame compariſon haue touched knowe god nature office wee muſt fall conſidering ſelues ſyde ende ſame may giue greater gloſſe god incomprehenſible glorie alſo manifolde miſeryes ſelues bee ſhort wee bee done vnderſtande text belongeth god deſtroy proude onely looke roote wicked vtterly inſomuche ſhall ſeeme haue theyr full ſcope bee cheefe ruffe ſhall ſwept away cleane earth god chalengeth himſelfe nowe men doo like haue wee looke able deſtroy enimies ſpecially make cleane riddaunce wicked furthermore let v marke heere god ſpeaketh abſolute lawleſſe power haue ſayde earſt power matched rightfulneſſe cauſe mention made purpoſely proud wicked ſort therefore let v marke well theſe two thing namely god doth magnifie himſelfe foraſmuch onely looke ouerthrow deſtroy wicked▪ yet notwithſtanding ſpareth creature vttereth ſayde power vpon proude wicked god almightie yet howſoeuer worlde go haue rightuouſneſſe knowne go haue men confeſſe according thing ſelfe ſheweth ſo vanquiſh affection luſtes ſuche yeelde ſubmitte themſelues maieſtie contrary part thundereth vpon ſuch preſume much vpon themſelues become prowde vſe replying incountering god make mortall enemie wee haue ſpoken god voyce ſo muſt wee nowe ſpeake looke countenaunce faythfull beſeech god ſhew countenance thing wherein conſiſteth al ioy happineſſe welfare according ſayde pſalme lorde ſhew v thy countenance ſhalbe ſafe al welfare contentation wiſh vvhat thing moſt deſired v god countenance like contrarywiſe turneth backe vpon v hideth himſelfe v muſt needes forlorne heart thing wherein man may finde reſt onely knowing god hath care long god vouchſaſeth haue eye vppon v wee haue whereof glad bee ſure mainteine v wee ſhall neede bee afrayde thing god forget v wittes ende without good cauſe wee bee left vp satan pray vpon hundred thouſand deathes beſet v round remedie v vve ſee god looke thing wiſhed ſpecially come humbleneſſe deſirouſneſſe true intent ſtick vnto loke aloft ſayd another place haue foreheade braſſe puffed vp vaunt ſelues god ſpite muſt bee faine looke vpon v another maner countenance ſhall ſerue cheere v vp deſtroy v vtterly needeth one looke god ridde men quite cleane worlde caſt proude looke agaynſt aud therefore let v learne ſayde heere namely god looking vpon proude ſort deſtroy vtterly bycauſe haue wicked looke vvherefore let v caſt downe heades go vnto god obeyſance therewithall let v pray lighten eye may ſeeke father looke vpon v ſuch wiſe may haue thereby perfectneſſe ioy true contentation reſt ſelues vpon way ſhewed v ſtreyne scripture ſpeaketh oftentymes god office ouerthrow ſuch aduaunce themſelues according ſayde whoſoeuer exalteth himſelfe ſhall bee brought low let v mark well god deadly vnreconciliable foad ſuch kepe within bound ne acknowledge owne ſlenderneſſe humbling themſelues needes make themſelues great men ſo god muſt fain incounter two muſt iuſtle togither vvere throughly conſidered ſhould need ſo many sermon bring v lowlineſſe horrible thing wormes earth ſhould come ſet purpoſe fight agaynſt god yet ſo ſuch preſume themſelues ſuch think valour al ſuch beare themſelues hand either wiſe vertuous rightuous ſuch ſay make warre againſt god though ſpeake mouth yet one ſo deed therfore god telleth v man cannot iuſtifie himſelfe ſo aſſaulteth heauē throughly perſuaded doctrine proude folkes god enimies prouoke wrath againſt themſelues would walk another maner meeldneſſe ſimplicitie ſeemeth v god ought ſhrinke away make v roome marke pray men beſot thēſelues neuertheleſſe woulde nowadayes herken doctrine frame ſelues thereafter ſhoulde length perceyue experience nought ſayde countenance lorde vpon loftie one roote worlde none meeke one haue euerlaſting heritage howbeit intent may profit leſſon let v marke well proude one pryde alwayes knowne vnto men condemne whoſoeuer truſteth owne ſtrength whoſoeuer preſumeth vpon owne rightuouſneſſe wiſedome whoſoeuer ſotteth himſelfe owne greatneſſe credit ſhort whoſoeuer wilfully ouerpaſſeth bound thing ſame proude bodie god men ouerpaſſe boundes euen thinke themſelues haue ſparke goodneſſe themſelues vntil ſuch time wee bee ye woulde ſay quite cleane emptied neither meekeneſſe meeldneſſe v furthermore god ſhall haue giuen v grace beſtowed giftes holy ſpirite vpon v let ſame make v ſet vp briſtles agaynſt offend wee haue good ſharpe vnderſtanding ſame commeth owne moother wit therefore wee muſt take occaſion exalt ſelues ſo much bound
