vnto god againe let greateſt indeuer ſerue ſmalleſt let deſpiſe thoſe god hath inhonoured ſetting like degree imagin thing v puffed vp pride diſdaine neighbour reaſon god gracious giftes preſumptuouſneſſe offendeth god prouoketh vengeance agaynſt v vvhat bee done wee haue god agaynſt v let v learne diſtruſt thing ſelues conceyue preſumption may lift v vp ſhort one worde let v ſay nothing agayne god aduaunce v honour aboue men indue v vertues let v acknowledge ſame come furthermore let v louing forbeare neighbour wrong deſpiſe ſuch god child well leaſtwiſe created one ſelfe ſame likeneſſe nature v thus much concerning ſayde god office b ••• e downe pride men looke addeth therevnto w • cked ſhewe enimie wicked folke generall howbeeit foraſmuch hardly auoyded pryde loftineſſe ſhoulde beare ſway forſomuch wicked ſort ruſhe foorth euill bee deſpyſers god therefore heere expreſſe long diſcourſe theſe lof • ie one forget themſelues beleeue bee able woorke woonders owne power men ſo proude diſpiſe god ſurely would holde themſelues ſtill giue bridle ſo theyr luſtes needes therefore muſte pryde carrie v awaye wee vſe violence outrage towardes neighbor deuour one fleece another al goodes ſhewe ſpite malice token feare god v know ſo much mortall men knowes howe hee hath iourney paſſe worlde life brittle tranſitorie certainly brydle himſelfe euen onely one reſpect therefore needes muſt men bewitched vtterly ignorant themſelues theyr ſtate ouerſhoote themſelues verely cauſe prophet abacuck ſayeth rightuous man ſhall liue fayth auoucheth contrarie part loftineſſe ſhall beaten downe vvhat meeneth loftineſſe meeneth ſturdineſſe againſt god ſcornefulneſſe agaynſt men howbeeit hee vſeth woorde loftineſſe bycauſe men forget themſelues wittes ouerſhoote themſelues ſort chafe agaynſt god nowe might bee demaunded whether god doth roote proud folk worlde lykelyhod rather ſpareth layeth reynes brydle looce theyr necke ſo tryumph theyr pleaſure howbeeit let v marke v appoynt terme ſay ſuche houre god ſhall confounde deſtroy proude folke hee howbeeit due ſeaſon therefore although proude folke beare ſway god ſeeme let doo liſt yea laugh ſleeues though power repreſſe yet hath ſtill office belongeth vnto namely rooting proude wicked ſort looke yea ſayde ſcripture ſometymes hydeth himſelf faythfull one euer forgetteth carefull ſheweth himſelfe outward working intent trie fayth pacience may ſeeme v god hath forgotten v daunger ſpecially wee feele blowes finally wee ſee death preſent meane wee perceyue god myndeth reach v hande yet euen wee crie vnto ala lorde art thou vvhy haſt thou forgotten mee complaint make wee according fleſhly vnderſtanding ſo god ſeemeth looke vpon proude hee ſuffereth caſt foorth poyſon faſhion beareth number outrage enormity commit yea foraſmuch time yet come let v tarie till god open eye vpon ſhall deſtroyed bee borne withall time god winke let v aſſure oure ſelues theyr turne yet come wherein hee looke vpon wrath roote ſayde afore leſſon ought ſerue double vſe faithful ought take comfort although god deliuer tyrannie wicked firſt brunt yet haue cauſe reſt vpon vvhy hath giuen ouer office though exalt themſelues againſt time yet come ſhall feede men ox like men know time kill oxe ſo doth god know well ynough day deſtruction proud wicked ye ſee firſt faithfull ought bee pacient ſee god delay rooting proud wicked ſort therfore muſt holde themſelues quiet till thing done meane let proud ſort bethinke themſelues let v afrayde flatter ſelues god ſpare v let v thinke bee ſcaped hande neither let v gather boldneſſe attempt one thing vnder colour beareth v winketh v ende hee looke vpon v ſhall fault bewrayed greater confuſion let v marke well although men perceiue god iudgements eyeſight day day yet muſt therfore ceaſſe walke feare carefulneſſe rather brideled worde god herein alſo doeth fayth ſhew ſelfe namely middes aduerſities faſten eies vpon god gracious promiſes ſide ſtate wicked ſeemeth better ſtate godly let v ceaſſe hope continually euerlaſting life although ſeene vvhy ſo bycauſe god hath promiſed whatſoeuer commeth mouth cannot deceiuable ye ſee ſort ought put leſſon vre let v ſee like thing reported heere god wee deſtroy wicked one onely looke wee rid earth proud folke god thinketh good ala let v learne giue glorie ſheweth himſelfe iudge worlde hath power hande vſeth ſuch order vprightneſſe fault bee found therwith although thing ſeeme oftentimes troubleſome order v yet let v ceaſſe looke ſtill power god ſheweth therwithall goodneſſe haue cleare eies ſurely wee ſhall neuer miſſe eſpie diſcerne god gouerneth worlde rightfully yee ſee way put leſſon practize wee knowe god himſelfe hath vttered himſelfe effect experience muſt come downe ſelues examin owne weakneſſe wee may humble ſelues attempt quarell god hathe perfection rightuouſneſſe power effect wee haue beare minde ſpecially let v wey well ſaying added concluſion wit man power hee able ſaue himſelfe owne hande ſayde god confeſſeth man might paſſe therefore v hathe power ſpoken heere hee needeth reſort heauen refuge call vppon god ſaue euery man might ſaue hymſelfe ſaying bring men knowe haue neede another bodie ſaue themſelues haue life hand neither meanes warrant let v conſider wee liue ſelues haue meane mainteyne ſelues yea although whole worlde fauored v ſo might ſeeme wee thing yet nothing muſt faine depende wholy vpon god ſaued hande let ſerue one poynt nowe firſt ſight ſeemeth bee meetely common thing men taught nature reſort vnto god yet ſee yee drunkenneſſe rather madneſſe whiche caryeth v away ſo euerie v opinion hee ſaue warrant himſelfe hath tolde v satan hath put falſe dotage intoo braine ſome power ſome rightuouſneſſe ſome wiſedome ſelues let v marke god vpbrayding v none v bee ſaued owne hand common ſchoole poynt ſerueth ſhew v muſt diſtruſt ſelues al owne power bee ſo vtterly diſabled may haue reſt ſtay contentment onely vvhat ſaueth v hande god wherefore euen owne mere free goodneſſe onely man thing himſelfe god woulde enuie woulde rather ſay verie well let v part ſtakes mine thine hath god neede borrowe v hath hee neede catche due right v furniſh hymſelfe withall let v imagin ſuch conceyts let v confeſſe ſo much one droppe ſafetie ſelues wee muſt runne ſimply vnto god wee haue marke thys ſtreyne neuertheleſſe true ſomtimes wicked ſhall bee deſtroyed throwne downe man hande ende iuſtice ordeyned ſit ſeate iuſtice holde ſworde hande thing themſelues bycauſe god hath appoynted bycauſe pleaſeth bee ſerued inſtruments meete meanes god hath ordeyned world ſet maieſtie power rightuouſneſſe ſhoulde deface hinder knowing glorie rather ſhoulde giue greater brightneſſe furthermore wee ſee howe hee worketh pleaſeth without putting man hande concluſion tolde v heere god hath created beaſtes sea lande euen terrible beaſtes able make v quake intent ſhuld bee ſo ſawcie come ſet ſelues againſt heere expreſſe mention made behemoth nowe woorde behema ſignifyeth ſimplie beaſt vnder name ox beaſtes comprehended heere ſayde plurall number looke vpon behemoth created thee although worde behemoth bee plurall number hebrew yet ſpoken one beaſt mo howbeeit foraſmuch god ment betoken heere one ſort beaſtes cauſe ſetteth behemoth plurall number neuertheleſſe cannot bee coniectured kinde beaſt ſpeaketh except bee elephant reaſon hougeneſſe beaſtes bodie euident ſpeaketh neither ox horſes ſuch beaſtes ſayde looke mee vpon behemoth cateth • ay oxe god maketh expreſſe difference betweene kinde beaſt whereof hee ſpeaketh ox therefore without troubling ſelues much matter let v marke god text hath chozen kinde beaſt woonderfull v ſame elephant hath ſo ſtrong bodie ſayde great bone braſſe little bone griſtles men terme barres yron incredible thing v acquainted ſee thoſe beaſts ought afrayde onely looke bigneſſe ſo houge ſeeme bee thing made arte nature wee wize ynough needed go ſelues behold maieſtie god howbeeit men muſt bee ſent beaſtes bycauſe vnthankefulneſſe know god ſheweth himſelfe vnto therfore reaſon blockiſhneſſe vnthankfulneſſe wee haue neede ſuch mirrours ſet v reſpect elephant like beaſtes seeing perceyue god hath created thoſe beaſts ſuch bigneſſe ſhape although wee none warrant power yet haue wee good cauſe holde downe heades woorſhippe high maieſtie ſheweth ſelfe thoſe wilde beaſtes purpoſely ſayde theſe elephantes created v intent ſhewe v god hath made difference betweene thing himſelfe liſted hee hath ſet woonderfull order worlde ſo men muſt needes bee rauiſhed beſides themſelues thinke thereon leaſtwiſe haue diſcretion marke thing wide open behold man hath little bodie neuertheleſſe appointed bee lorde maiſter worlde vvherefore thing created onely vſe ſee elephant ſo ſtrong able ſtrike great ſort mē one ſtroke foote ſith wee ſee ſuche thing ſuch order worlde doth well ſhewe vnto v god hath done v great fauour making v ſo little bee yet notwithſtanding hath ſhewed himſelf brute beaſtes alſo inſomuche knowledge thing put ſelues ynough v wee looke vpon beaſtes wee ſhall finde thing aſtoniſh wittes therewithall alſo let v marke well gouerning ſhoulde go greatneſſe might elephant well reigne ouer v wee ſee ſuffer themſelues bee ruled men like little coltes ſtable alſo ſee ſide god hath left deſtitute many thing beholde houge body yet notwithſtanding cannot bow legges faine ſtande continually elephant downe vpon ground hee cannot get vp againe ſee ſuch force one ſide ſuch default wit thoſe beaſtes cannot bow legges faine ſleepe ſtanding inſomuch elephant layd flat cannot ryſe againe alone man good rayze vp whole houſe ought ſuch ſight make v glorifie god goodneſſe whereof long elephant deuour v eate hay ox seing theſe beaſts able execute ſuch crueltie roote mankinde worlde doo feede graſſe mountaynes hyde themſelues vnder ſhadowes tree yet notwithſtanding breake ſuch rage might doo reaſon hougeneſſe whereof commeth god tame ende giue v roome dwell heere beneath againe whereas wee bee hemmed ſydes ſo many ſortes wilde beaſtes coulde wee continue vndeuoured one day worlde god reſtreyned rage ſecrete brydle therefore let v learne looke ſo vppon god workes wee may worthily magnifie power goodneſſe wiſedome rightuouſneſſe humbling yea euen vtter diſabling ſelues according deede nothing nowe let v fall downe face oure good god acknowledgment ſinnes praying make v ſo feele may learne walke feare put v wholy handes without preſuming thing vpon ſelues rather acknowledging weakneſſe infirmitie beſeeching helpe v foraſmuch ſhoulde bee ouercome hundred thouſande time day defence ſheeld ſafegarde may pleaſe garde v frōal ſpirituall foe deliuer v temptation giuing v power outſtande tyll haue taken v earthly lyfe continuall battell may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c clvj sermon third vpon xl chapter first vpon xlj chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon last ten verſes vpon text following 20 canſt thou dravv vp leuiathan vvith hooke binde tongue vvith corde 21 vvilt thou put hooke nozethrils perce chavves vvith angle 22 vvill make much intreatance thee vvill ſpeake thee fayre 23 vvill make couenant vvith thee vvilt thou take ſeruant euer 24 vvilt thou play vvith vvith littlebird vvilt thou bind thy yong maydes 25 shall companion make feaſt ſhall merchant deuide among 26 vvilt thou fill basket vvith skin fiſhers dorſer vvith head 27 lay thy hande vpon remember battell go 28 behold hope diſappoynted ſhall fall dovvne ſight xlj chapter man ſo cruell dareth vvake vppe vvho hee ſhall ſtande preſence 2 vvho vvill preuent vvill ſatiſfie vnder heauen mine 3 vvill conceale member povver comlineſſe making 4 vvho vvill open foreparte garment vvho ſhall come vvith double bridle 5 vvho ſhall open gate face rovves ſo terrible teeth 6 ſcales ſtrong ſheeldes faſt ſet print ſeale 7 one clozed another ſo vvind cannot get 8 ſhet one vvithin another cleaue togither cannot ſundred 9 neezing like ſhining light eies davvning day 10 mouth go lampes ſparkes fire leape 11 smoke ſteameth noze ſeething pot cauldron 12 breath ſetteth cole fire flame flaſheth mouth 13 neck dvvelleth ſtrength labour reiected face 14 partes fleſh knit togither euery one ſubſtantiall ſelfe vvithout fleeting 15 hart ſubſtantiall ſtone hard neather milſtone 16 mightie afrayd vvhen riſeth vp vvaues troubled 17 vvhen ſvvorde toucheth hee vvill ſtay ſpeare dart habergeon 18 regardeth yron ſtravv braſſe rotten vvood 19 archer cannot put flight ſtones ſling turned ſtubble vnto 20 eſteemeth dart much ſtubble laugheth ſhaking ſpeare 21 vnder ſharpe ſtones ſpreadeth ſharpe poynted thing vpon myre 22 maketh deepe ſeeth like cauldron maketh ſea like pot oyntment 23 maketh path ſhine eſteemeth deepe olde thing 24 dominion vpon earth made afrayde nothing 25 beholdeth high thing king ouer child pride shewed yeſterday god ſet forth many liuing thing earth witneſſe power glory bringeth one ſide elephant ſide whale ſerueth conclude matter although men ſee god yet ought perceyne maieſtie beholding beaſtes hee hath created ſpecially ſuch able fray v looke ende god might glorified ſo much hand againe ſawe yeſterday diſcourſed concerning elephant terrible houge beaſt ynough ſcare v wittes tremble ſight beaſt ſhould play bold fellowes againſt god contende chaſtizeth v ſtomacke matter hee intendeth humble v ſuch fooles murmure iuſtice gainſay thing deſire deface diminiſh ſoueraintie ſeeing beaſtes make men tremble let conſider owne madneſſe matching themſelues god howbeeit go whereas heere ſo long diſcourſe vppon ſayde kynde beaſtes lande whiche ſayde elephant albeeit bee named heere generall terme behemoth alſo vppon leuiathan wee haue marke therevpon howe menne haue beene opinion allegorie diuell ſpoken heere rather eyther elephant vvhale haue gone aboute proue fantaſticall deuice theyrs ende ſayde ſayd vvhale king child pride ſpeaking kinde beaſt touched yeſterday ſayde god maketh eate hay graſſe like ox vvee ſee intent ſhewe v god mightie power thing bee ſeene deſcribe diuell v touching woorde leuiathan whole ſcripture ſignifieth vvhale ſee bee ſo hundred fourth pſalme hebrew woorde leuiathan tranſlated vvhale well ynough knowne prophete ſpeaketh god wonder men ſee ſea yea much vpon lande one peremptorie reaſon ſhewe v muſt take text ſimplie ſtandeth ſhiftingly haue ſeene heretofore god intent teache men groſſe homely maner according owne ſmall capacitie dooing therof end mightie power ſhould better proued vnto moreouer ment alſo vpbrayd follie dare ſet themſelues againſt forſomuch verie beaſtes able reproue vvherfore let v marke well heere god giueth men leſſon thereby skorne pryde ſending brute beaſts could take place ſpoken diuell wheras whale ſhould king child pryde beaſt hath ſuch affection rather ſayd compare men vvhale lord ſhould ſay true men lift vp ſheelds verie hygh fetch leapes aboue cloudes haue gathered force preſumed vttermoſt compariſon vvhale vvhen man hath vaunted himſelfe vttermoſte let come incounter whale whale ſhall haue cauſe vaunt himſelf man compare houſe tower man compare artillerie man compare mountayne hee ſhall finde theſe quality yea hee ſhall finde ſuch terrible force able turne vp ſhippes vpſide downe man approche vntoo ſuch ſtrength vvee ſee god hath ſhewed expreſly wee ſhall always ouercome vvhales therfore pryde fond ſpecially become ſo bold lift vp ourſelues againſt go plucke thing belong robbe ryghtuouſeneſſe ſo wee muſt needes bee put ſhame yea euen without god comming downe heauen without ſhewing maieſtie verie beaſts ynough maynteyne honour neuertheleſſe truely conueying diſcourſe one man myght well vſe ſimilitude whale elephant make men perceyue greatly power diuell ought fray v ſeing termed prince aire world without cauſe doth god giue title intent ſeing bee ſo weake ſelues haue ſo myghtie ſtrōg enimie ſhould walke feare therfore may well one take good warning ſubiect god muſt bondſlaues satan hee ſhall ouermayſter v well ynough ſo wee ſhall haue ſtrength withſtand example wheras creation worlde ſpoken moyſes treateth angel ment teacher little vnlerned one therfore ſetteth thoſe thing ſeene eye yet preſent lyght perceyued muſt leade v yet wit eſpying lyght heauenly kingdome fayth though bee hidden v preſently foraſmuchas wee ſee god maieſtie ſhyneth foorth euery lette v vnderſtand farre greater fulneſſe perfection lyght angel thing concerne heauenly lyfe ye ſee good conueyance go ſo degree leaſt thing greateſt loweſt hygheſt yet howſoeuer deale muſt hold v ſtill ſimplicitie text euill thing dally holie ſcripture tranſforming intoo allegory nother ought allegory bee drawen naturall meening wee ſee sainct paule doth epiſtle galathians place therfore let v come backe againe matter wee began god doth make triumphes bothe ſea land ende men ſhoulde knowe ſhall alwayes bee confounded pryde ſet themſelues againſt hee ſpoken manie ſorts beaſtes heere ſetteth elephant v ſo terrible muſt needes amaze v howge bigneſſe body wee behold miracle without number vve ſee one ſide ſurmount v ſee ſide god hath giuen thing hee hath voutſafed giue v yea euen owne free goodneſſe therfore let v learne ſhall gayne nothing exalting ourſelues ſhal ſurmounted brute beaſts haue done yet notwithſtanding vnthankefulneſſe bewrayeth ſelfe yeelde ſlender nigardly recompence vnto god benefit hee hath beſtowed vpon v long wee brute beaſtes ſaid yeſterday elephant created v made preciouſer mould qualitie v ſhould excellent nothing maketh difference betwixt v god wee ſee elephant haue ſo terrible force notwithſtanding ſo bold bend themſelues agaynſt v go hyde themſelues moyſt place cannot haue couert commodiouſe seing ſo ſee one ſide greatly bee bounde vnto god therfore wee ought good reaſon acknowledge owne weakneſſe mention made brute beaſtes durſt come neere ſo much looke vppon ſhould god reſtreyned god leadeth v ſea ſheweth v alſo haue wherwith pull v downe reaſon greate multitude diuerſitie fiſſhes ſeene inſomuch euen heathen misbeleeuing wryters conſtreyned ſay wheras men ſawe manie miracle vpon land ſea true ſtorehouſe woonders nature alſo euē reſpect anye one ſorte kynd thē exāple let v take whale incredible thing ſee ſo houge creature liuing water able faſhion mould ſo great howge ſtrong beaſt ſeene lykelyhood ſhould come foorth pray vpon land ſhuld foode ynough ſuffize water alſo ſee bone backebones bone ſee yron ſteele woonder looke vpon fleſſhineſſe therfore man neede greate rich ſhuld interteyne ſuch bodye ſted turne god hath appointed world keepe therfore hath prouided thing vvherfore ſith wee ſee let v learne ſubmit ourſelues elſe ſhall neede none iudges condemne v brute beaſtes nother ſhall neede euidence caſt v creature diſperſed world well water vpon land away ſingleneſſe ſtand v better ſted curiouſe expoſitions deuyſed theſe allegorimakers ſerched ribbes backebones treated alſo skin ſhort pece wherin found ſome toy make holie ſcripture noze wax transforming naturall ſenſe vvherfore wee beare away one foreſayd article ſhall neede none witneſſe caſt v god thā thing ſhewed brute beaſtes ſhall wee haue profited greatly howbeeit come condemning god ſight haue good inſtruction giuen v receyue firſt intent wee may aſhamed taught vvhales elephant let v vnderſtand god ſending v euen bycauſe vntowardneſſe wee bee ſo ſpytefull ſo froward ſo wicked crabbed nature cannot bee brought reaſon therfore god fayne ſhame v ſending v beaſtes alſo ſuch wilfulſtubbornneſſe v whatſoeuer told v though want layd open face yet euer ſeeke ſome ſtartingholes ſhun god iudgement vttermoſt power god muſt bee fayne breake hardeneſſe mayne force make v bow vnder therfore elephant ſhould treade v vnder feete trā ple vpon belly v well woorthie ſeing wee glorifie hath made well v yeld due honour howbeit let v take good worth god ſendeth v thē ſchole learne humble ſelues beſides deſerue ſwallowed vp vvhales haue ſea ouerwhelme whole earth ſo ſhould hath bin declared heretofore god graciouſe goodneſſe voutſafeth lodge v heere maynteyne v notwithſtanding deſerue drouned euery minute houre vvherfore let v contented god giueth v inſtruction bothe vpon ſea land al thing ordeyned turne welfare according alſo ſhall wee turne away owne rechleſneſſe ignorance naughtineſſe thus yee ſee che • f poynt wee haue marke text howbeit vnfold deſcription peece peece let v marke ſayd god declareth intent ſpeaketh ſo vvhale vvho ſayeth god ſtand preſence seing man dareth waken vp whale com neere ſayth dareth maynteyne himſelfe mee compariſon haue touched alreadye witte creature nothing themſelues ſmall portion power god aſtoniſh v infinite maieſtie doo vvhat whole world reſpect god ſayd holdeth bothe heauen earth needeth ſtretch armes imbrace greate circuit al ſhet cloce hand whale houge maſſe fleſhe ſo euer hee haue yea though hee neuer ſo much ſea verie ſmall peece beſides infinite number fiſſhes greate ſmal ſea god hath made gouerneth whale alſo compriſed seing god glorie comprehē deth thing yea comprehendeth nothing ought wee ſore aſtoniſhed ſillie beaſt ſcareth v ſhewed confirmation therof ſayd thing man ſhould ſay true whale terrible thing god ſo yea would god anſwer whale dart ſhall caſt ſtone ſling behoueth v knowe god hath printed ſome marke power whale greate beaſts intent men ſhould knowe ſame proceedeth hand hee ſerueth turne apply ſuch vſe hee liſteth inſomuch whale ought ſight bee conſidered god ſhuld caſt ſtone ſling ayre rang ſo aſtoniſhed seing thing ſo hand haue good cauſe tremble neuertheleſſe lord meeneth driue v yet muſt wee need bee abaſſhed firſt brunt end wee may yeeld deſerued reuerence calleth allureth v intent ſhould find ioyfulneſſe yet come till haue bene vtterly beaten downe therfore muſt firſt go feare daunt v ſuch wiſe may able ſtand may find ourſelues vtterly vndone eaſt away god ſhuld vtter power againſt v behoueth v knowe thē ſhall feare aſſwaged wit wee hold father yet ſhall neuer yeeld due reuerence except daunt v tame v ſuch wiſe v knowe become thing wee haue remember ſtreyne ſo let v followe generall leſſon vnpoſsible mortal creature ſtand god ſhould ſtand firſt formeſt muſt need caſt v flat ground afterward ſet v vp againe wil hold owne fall playing luſtie tall ladds ſhall neuer bring purpoſe paſſe ſhall rather bee cauſe decay woord ſtand betokeneth man neuer haue good cace maynteyning himſelf ryghtuouſe wiſe muſt firſt vtterly diſabled acknowledge god hath myght power ryghtuouſeneſſe cannot ouerwhelmed owne nature true god would ſhould ſtand alſo lifteth v vp aboue heauens reſpect body yet rayſing v vp beaten downe let v marke well greate oddes betweene mennes deſyring ſomwhat themſelues taking vpon bee wiſe ryghtuouſe betweene vtter diſclayming goodneſſe therevpon reſort vnto god pray ſet good ſtate forſomuchas vtterly bereft glorie haue nothing themſelues ſhamefull confuſion vvhen haue learned leſſon mā able ſtand god ſo acknowledge nothing v filthineſſe dung gay likelyhod wee weene ourſelues haue nothing vanitie opinion haue conceyued beguile v whē throughly perſuaded wil god lift v vp wil think ourſelues ſo beholden mere grace thing wil glorifie father giuer vnto v yea euen without bound thervnto without finding anie deſert v generall principle faith fleſh muſt keepe ſilēce behoueth v vnderſtand bee luſtineſſe v withereth away hand needeth one blaſt vpon v wee fade away without hartineſſe ſtrength ryghtuouſneſſe curſedneſſe pray marke generall principle fayth ende grace manifeſted v lord ieſus chriſt may knowne haue recourſe thervnto looking eyther beginning full perfecting ſaluation elſewhere god voutſafing worke ſame freely ſay without bynding ſide without bringing thing owne behalfe cauſe hee expreſly addeth preuent mee ſatisfie hee ſhould ſay wee pleade agaynſt hee muſt needes bee det bee bound vnto v wee muſt haue ſome ryght intereſt ſhall man bee found may preferre title vntoo god ſay god bound vntoo wee ſee cleane contrarywiſe wee hold thing ſide oweth nothing vnto v yet notwithſtāding ſo wilful needes cōtēd let extended generally teach v wee muſt humble ſelues vnder god mightie hand confeſsing bothe wiſe rightuouſe mightie thing doeth sainct paule ſheweth eleuenth romaynes although alledge text taken holie ſcripture yet doeth reherſe ſame doctrine purpoſe treateth god free election ſheweth god choze liſted heires ouerlaſting lyfe alſo forſooke liſted man ſhould demaund reaſon v knowe nother lawfull v ſeeke ought bee ſted reaſon vnto v hee doeth thing vniuſtly bycauſe ſecretes mynd hidden incomprehenſible v wayes vnknowne v howbeeit foraſmuch hard men hold themſelues quiet doctrine according ſee theſe doggs bark againſt nowdayes theſe gloriouſe beggers intending play greate doctor ſay comprehend art thou thou wretched dogge doeſt thou comprehend get thee vp vpon thy dunghill learne knowe thou art foraſmuch men ſo proud cannot find hart ſubmit themſelues doctrine sainct paule twiteth ſaying vvho hath giuen aught vnto god ſtep foorth heere greate boldneſſe yee alledge owne vertues ſtrength therfore meete ſhould ſhewe god hee ſhould nothing bee doone otherwyſe appoynt ſo greatly bound vnto ye pretend ſuch matter againſt come let v knowe haue giuen yee knowe hee nothing beholden vnto dare yee murmure againſt ſeing sainct paule dealeth maner wee knowe meening cace god euerlaſting election therevpon wee haue remember one principle fayth beleeue god holdeth thing v alledge hath receyued aught hand glorie muſt giuen vnto wee thinke hee vnderling hee thing bownd vnto v matter lieth well practizing leſſon ſpecially fleſh tempteth v preſumptiō pride may reſtreyned bridle conſider matcheſt thou thyſelf thou wilt go lawe thy god behoueth thee well armed anſwer wilt thou ſay seing thou haſte nothing wretchednes curſedneſſe thee would ſtād thee hand ſubmit thyſelf obedience humilitie let v marke alſo thoſe word rightuouſeneſſe men beaten downe ſhewed v euer imagin concerning merit deſeruing work drunkenneſſe satan hath ſo bewitched mennes vnderſtanding opiniō deſeruing godward kingdome heauen made wage poperie nothing common ſay men purchace heauen meritorious woorks terme although papiſts bee forced confeſſe wee nothing without god grace wee haue alwayes ſome imperfection v yet doo mingle owne woorks god grace man ſay muſt prepare himſelf receiue god grace worthineſſe forced graunt owne vnwoorthineſſe conueniencie bycauſe ſay conuenient ſeemely man ſhould offer diſpoze himſelf afore hand receiue god grace expreſſe belying holie ghoſte behold heere ſaying cleere ynough needeth gloze •• hath preuented bene afore hand ſayeth lord let v marke well heere god bereeueth mankynd falſe diueliſh opinion wherwith ſo beſotted ſaying hee bound vnto v wee vnto ſo wee cannot bring aught vnto nother doth receiue recompence hand ſeruice wee vnto hee hath neede v ſee effect wiſdome rightuouſeneſſe man beaten downe brought nothing twoo thing make v lift vp ourſelues againſt god one wee weene ourſelues wiſe wee think haue ſome rightuouſeneſſe woorthineſſe ourſelues howbeit god ſheweth v one part may wel pratle prate end put v ſilence well ynough vvhyſo title wee pretend againſt let v forbeare ſelfwyſe learne ſober lowely let v acquaynt ſelues god woorkes ſo farre foorth ſheweth v always reſtreyning ſelues bridle wee paſſe ſhewed v holie ſcripture wee ſo ſhall guided alwayes holie ghoſt let v keepe ourſelues ſaying would faine know ſuch thing let v ſelfwiſe ſeeking whatſoeuer haue mind vnto ought know let v contented opened v holie ſcripture ſpecially thing may edifie v fayth feare god meete thing ſeemeth ſtraunge v yet let v conſider god hath ſpoken therfore muſt receyue without gaynſaying furthermore god let thing alone tel v behoueth v ſtoppe without going muſt inquiſitiue owne fancie therfore mark ſchoole point behoueth v bridle toungs ſuffer ourſelues ſchollers god ſeing doth v honour teache v well owne mouthe alſo holie ſpirit ſecond point concerneth rightuouſeneſſe conuicted haue woorthineſſe v haue done neuer ſo much yet wee bring nothing vnto god wee ſhould yeld ourſelues giltie much worſe men ſo farre giuing themſelues good imploy force power euil vntill god haue reformed knowe put vre muſt pretend haue worthineſſe deſeruing ſelues yeeld god honour graunt almightie throughly humbled reſpects effect thing wee haue beare away text knit vp matter although needfull expedient ſtand vpon euery woord long diſcourſe made whale yet let v aſſure ſelues ſuperfluouſe vvee looke ſlyghtly glauncingly vpon recordes god giueth v maieſtie witts well ſetled marke god ſheweth v end might honour accordingly wee needed go ſelues wee ſhuld find preſidents ynow bothe power ſo wee ſhould behold bothe myghtineſſe goodneſſe within v without going paule meeneth ſaying aſmuchas haue life mouing ſufficiently conuicted though opē eye yet doth god make v feele fingars dwelleth v hee ſetteth forth himſelfe ſuch wiſe wee ought dutie honour notwithſtanding fall ſtubborneſſe wheras wee well aduiſed good diſcretion ſhould neede ye would ſay tippe one little fingar hold v obedience vnto god bee aſmuchas wee ouerpaſſe make greate reckning god woorks therfore heere made long diſcourſe yea altogether vpon beaſts seing god maketh heere long anatomie ſeemeth long deede yet ſuperfluouſe bycauſe wee ſo fleeting wee deſpize god miracle greate noble ſo euer bee thus ye ſee wee haue marke firſt place herewithall ſayd wilt thou hold thy ſeruice wilt thou put bookes noze wilt thou play ſpaniell bird▪ v wit wee ſo much leſſe excuzed wee acknowledge maker ſeing finde ſelues confounded making compariſon betweene v whale yet men diſpute god woorks owne brayne control contented hee woorke lyking one would ouerthrowe poſsible behold brute beaſte men cānot tell tame true compariſon peculiarly fit reſpects nother requiſite ſimilitudes ſhuld match fully anſwerably euery poynt ſerueth ſhewe ſillie beaſte hath nother reaſon vnderſtanding hath ſuch force make v afraid runne away ſhall hath made faſhioned thing men dare waken vp whale dareth hee ſtep forth make warre liuing god fall carping quareling much lieth behold lord would fayne ſhewe himſelf gentle louing towards v verie deede ſee willing beare weakneſſe play madman wild beaſtes fall carping openly though wee defiance wee able abyde preſence shall bee much terrible v preſence vvhale ſeing ſayd whale doo make deepe ſee like cauldron iumble ſea together like pot oyntment according alſo ſayd elephāt tha • would make riuer iordan paſſe throte pray wee agaſt ſee beaſte poynt ſwallowe vp houge water much agaſt ought wee maieſtie god myght ſeeme v vvhale might choked middes water yet notwithſtanding hee ſo greate houge beaſte hee cutteth ſea aſunder maketh boyle like pot ſnorting neezing termed ouerturneth ſhippes like ſwallowe vp commeth way ſhall lord neezing greater whale yes hath ſnorting ſpoken prophet eſay alſo hundred fourth pſalme inſomuch god puffe blowe vpon v muſt needes deſtroyed firſt blaſt seing ſuch terribleneſſe nozethrils beaſt breth god welſpring power eyther ſet v vp quicken v ouerthrowe v vndoo v vvee ſee theſe part ſet downe touched without cauſe theſe kind beaſts picked good inſtruction leaſtwyſe haue diſcretion apply theſe thing god make ſuch compariſons haue ſpoken vvheras mention made hardneſſe whale fleſh bone behoueth v come cōſideratiō vvhat ſhal become v god lift vp hand againſt v see whale ouerturneth greate ſhippes drouneth ſea hath god barres yron farre harder ſtrike v downe hee liſt touche v hand let v go iuſtle seing perceiue ſo well infinite power god hād arme ſpecially whē armed againſt v may well ſee treating ſort vvhales fleſh bone ſuperfluouſe talk ſide let v conſider alſo beaſt haue ſuch power him▪ inſomuch ſayd laugheth ſhaking ſpeares afrayd ſwoord weapon thereby ſhewed v wee armed power god good ſuretie haue cauſe afraid take thought thing vvee ſee god hath giuen ſuch ſtrength vnto beaſts thē ſhould truſt protection furthermore let v mark wel al ſtrength power vvhales beaſts ſhall periſhe terrible ſo euer according alſo doth periſh pleaſeth god therfore behoueth v beare mind wee muſt truſt ourſelues great follie wee muſt repaire hath power might ſelf may profit better leſſon let v mark foraſmuch ſee god hād lifted vp trouble whole world muſt one ſide learne diſtruſt ourſelues diſable ſelues knowing owne infirmity yet notwithſtanding ceaſſe glorie god ſeing vphilde power lo ought walk lowelineſſe one part ſide whē reſorte god leane vnto fauour protectiō may defie al enimies world alſo euē satā himſelf al power al euer able practize thus ye ſee two thing requiſite ſpecially lord warneth v perill ſee thing order wee muſt haue eye owne weakeneſſe vtterly diſtruſt ſelues yet notwithſtanding diſabling ſelues ceaſſe looke vp heauen douting haue good warrant forſomuch wee mainteyned wiſe preſuming vpō ourſelues thinketh hath power himſelf cā ouerthrowe himſelf let v learne chalendge aught ourſelues rather abace ourſelues vtterly yet notwithſtanding conceiue ſuch boldneſſe vpon truſt god protection wee may doubt able ynough tō defend v hundred thouſand deathes ſobeit referre ſelues wholly vnto truſt wil always guide v hand although muſt faine paſſe trouble diſorders world inuironed hundred thouſand deathes yet notwithſtāding make v feele help giue v power get till haue drawne v fully himſelf bee come endleſſe reſt hath prepared v let v fall face good god acknowledgemēt ſinnes praying make v ſo fele poore miſerable vpō knowing goodneſſe loue towards v wee may couet nothing yeld due glorie beſtowing ſo many graciouſe benefites vpon v hath made v lord maiſters creature bylowe able ſcare v witts ſo may vnthankful ſuch priuiledge prerogatiue hee hath graunted v homage benefit haue receiued hand wayting haue increaſe euen till haue brought v ful perfectiō ſo let v ſay almightie god c clvij sermon firſt vpon xlij chapter iob anſvvered lord ſayd 2 knovve thou canſt doo thing thought ſhall kept backe thee 3 vvho hee darkeneth ſecrets vvithout knovvedge ſpake vnderſtoode theſe thing vvonderfull aboue mee haue knovvne 4 herken therfore vvill ſpeake▪ vvill aske thee end thou mayſt teach mee 5 haue herd thee vvith myne eare novv myne eye hath ſeenethee ſawe heeretofore frute grew declaration god made vntoo iob whereas hee doubled woordes appeered euidently vnto v much hee profited correction alredye repented touched quicke ſo ſee god hath taught v oftentymes ſame profiteth v part although think nothing amiſſe come right point yet ſhall little preparatiue god therfore muſt fayne hold teaching v doctrine wee haue herd may better rooted hart wee bee moued ſettle ſelues wholly ſhort ſee repentance perfected firſt daſh god hath planed v neede alſo pooliſh v like man maketh peece woorke wood ſtone hee muſt haue much heawing ſame way alſo muſt lord take v elſe ſhall haue ſmall entrance repentance ſame vaniſh away by▪ elſe continue rude vnperfect thing cauſe muſt ſuffer god patiētly correcting v fault cōtent himſelf one ſtroke rodde pay v double profit furthermore wee haue herd good inſtruction welfare haue receiued ſame let v aſſure ourſelues ſmal taſt ſo yet rightly repented haue neede go new vvherfore let v leaue doctrin haue herd let v indeuer profit dayly knowing behoueth v draw neerer nerer vnto god day lyfe ſtabliſhed ſtill feare loue elſe without vnſtedfaſt returne old byaſſe whē think ourſelues wholly brought home ſhall nothing ſmoke vaniſh away hand yee ſee wee haue beare mynd alſo according iobs example haue cōſidered fault one day let v ſtreyne ourſelues knowe yet better next day greeued think haue diſcharged dutie ſaying one word conceyuing ſome one good thought wee deceyue ourſelues repentance muſt alwayes conquerout inſomuch vnfeyned muſt doubled let v come ſayd heere knowe thou canst thing thought ſhall bee kept back letted thee expound though iob yeelded power might vnto god therwithall alſo infinite forecaſt prouide thing guide though ſhould ſay lord knowe thou haſte al thing thy hand nothing hidden frō thee thou art priuie thing common maner ſpeche amōg hebrewes ſay thought ſhall bee letted thee ſay whatſoeuer thou haſte ordeyned commaunded yea whatſoeuer thou haſte intended thy mynde ſhall euery whit bee redily executed ſo thou ſhalt neede trouble thyſelfe though thou letted though thou couldeſt fayle thing let v marke ſpoken ſimply god infinite power twoo ſayings verified bothe one thing god therfore almightie looke hee purpoſeth minde execute byandby without lette ſhoulde ſeeme iob heere confeſſeth hee ought proteſted heretofore god ruleth world yet ceaſſed murmur againſt ſeemeth hath profited whit returneth ſtil foreſayd article although god almightie yet fayleth vſe ouergreat rigor ſo poore creature ſuffer much tormēted exceſsiuely hand howbeit muſt cōſider iob acknowledgeth god almightineſſe another maner doone afore wit humbling himſelf vnder god mightie hand acknowledging mortall men reſiſt checke againſt sometymes wee ſay god hath thing hand guiding meane whyle wee ceaſſe fret repyne thing lyking wherof commeth euen haue throughly conceyued hygh power ſubmit ſelues conſidered almightie guideth al thing iuſtly vprightly ſo good reaſon ſhould handle v weeld v liſteth wee keepe mouthes ſhet without replying thing doth thē acknowledge god almightineſſe vtter diſabling ourſelues vnder confeſsing good reaſon ſhould reigne haue authoritie ouer v ſhould obey yea conſtreynt meeke meeld mind doubtleſſe true cōfeſsing god almightie wee take vpon v aboue handle mind haue followe will according conceyts imagination ala euill acknowledging almightineſſe wee would bee fellowes yea would aboue point therfore let v mark well iob treateth god almightineſſe another ſenſe heere hath done heretofore woorſhippeth god ſouerein dominion acknowledgeth al thing muſt need guided office gouerne men haue cauſe murmure hee afflicteth v although thing hard troubleſome yet muſt always come point inaſmuch rightuouſe cānot deale amiſſe becōmeth v pleaſe yeeld ourſelues priſoners handled guided pleaſeth moreouer hold good thing hand thus ye ſee wiſe ought acknowledge god almightie ſecond mēber iob defineth god almightineſſe behoueth v cōceiue ſpeaketh god thoughtes vve ſee many fantaſtical perſons talke god almightineſſe fal gazing ſaying god almightie doth ſuch thing god almightie yea muſt raunge abrode ſo imaginaciōs god almightineſſe ameth dotage common thing vvhereat thē god almightineſſe wil thing inſeparable god almightie whatſoeuer man hath forged brayne fie accompliſh whatſoeuer hee hath ordeyned owne purpoſe let v learne knit theſe two thing togither namely almightineſſe cauſe iob ſaid thought ſhall letted kept backe reſ • reyned frō ſhuld execute thing men cōceiue determine thē haue will thing god hath ordeyned knoweth good ſee maner god almightineſſe ought knowne v namely end ſhuld doubt al thing ſhal done ſhal haue determined taking cō ſell hāds bycauſe aſsignement appoint good done forſomuchas foū taine al wiſdome al theſe thing ſo hand nothing hinder accompliſhing whatſoeuer hath deuiſed bee better vnderſtoode practiſing blame god almightineſſe without cauſe reaſon fall ſeeking matter ſaying▪ vvhy doth god ſuch thing ſeing hee almightie yea v make play trick fro belō geth determine apoint afterward bring alſo paſſe yet notwithſtāding thoſe foreward fellowes take heed graūting power vnto god whē cōmeth point ſhould truſt yet verie thing whervnto ſhould apply god almightineſſe faile keepe promis foraſmuch welfare hand wee ſure none euil betide v ſith hath v protection doubt enimie ſhall preuayle againſt v ſay cauſe ſhould minde god almightineſſe according ſhewed v ſayd man ſhall plucke v chriſts hād hath taken v keping father hath committed v ſtronger al vvhy end hath ieſus chriſt alledged v inuincible power god father end wee ſhuld quiet doubt wil ſaue v notwithſtanding al attēpts satā deuiſe god almightie herein ſee wee muſt ioyne god almightineſſe good wil euen ſuch ſheweth word point ſhall giue ourſelues bridle gaze raunge abrode yet ſhall haue alſo wherwith beate back skornes ſuch find hart play god almightineſſe tennisbal example looke vpon papiſts wil need haue bread chaunged bodie ieſus chriſte thing whiche bread ſhuld become god proue ſaying alledge god almightie yes end wil darken ſunne turne moone water make earth heauen heauen earth playne mocking god fall treating almightineſſe maner ouerthrowing peruerting order laboring might difference betwixt whyte blacke wicked rending aſunder god mightie power laying open reproch wherof cōmeth bycauſe papiſts haue yet learned leſſon ſhewed v heere wit god almightie accompliſh whatſoeuer purpoſeth doo purpoſe god behalf becommeth v looke whither god wil therfore haue god warrāt thē muſt alſo extend mightie power performing thing hath ordeyned let v think lord wil haue mē make almightineſſe roue raunge thinke good vvherfore let v beare leſsō mind ſhewed v ſeing god hath ſhewed v wil concerning welfare ſoulehelth aſſuring v wil mainteyne v end ſuccour v neceſsities lift v vp whē downe ſtrengthen v weakneſſe ſeyng ſay haue god apparant al theſe thing let v doubt hath hād ſtretched performe whatſoeuer hath ſpoken v ye ſee god hād mouth muſt agree togither mouth ſay determinacion muſt go afterward hand muſt bring paſſe thing hath determined haue theſe two thing wit firſt muſt ſubmit ourſelues wholly god ordinance world good beſides wee knowe alſo charge office gouerne good reaſon creature ſhould ſuffer themſelues ruled take libertie rule themſelues ſubmit themſelues al point al reſpects vvhen fully perſuaded ſhal haue profited greatly al life heere followeth immediately bydeth ſecrets without knowledge god hath heretofore vpbrayded iob herewith ſhuld ſeeme iob mēt cōfeſſe ſo deede wit wrapped vp god wiſdome foliſh word reaſon god woorks owne abilitie take vpon v iudgers hyding wrapping vp ſecrets ſay brabling men terme euen without skil would wiſe whē talk faſhyon haue bene taught afore ye ſee wee may take text confeſsing thing bin caſt iobs teeth ſhould ſay ala lord rightly haſte thou condemned heere tooke vpon mee wrap vp thy ſecrets without knowing whervnto word reaſons tēded know nowe haue delt foliſhly mee haue accepted ſimply whatſoeuer pleaſed thee apoint haue taken vpon mee play mayſter gone ſchole ſelf lord acknowledge thou haſt good right bewrayed follie nowe take maner dothe iob make confeſsion wherin attributeth ſuch vnto god matched al knowledge cōtrarietie betweene god men god keepeth determinacion ſecret howbeit knoweth cauſe doo ſo hath always reaſon redy ſhaped ſide go diſcouer god lawfull v intangle done without skil inſomuch wee go ſhewe ourſelues skilful bewray beaſtlineſſe one ſide let v learne god keepe ſecrets himſelfe without making v priuie thē ſpecially ſeeth ſame ſurmount ſmall capacitie god openeth thing vnto v knoweth meete expedient v hath bin declared heretofore yet muſte reſerue many dark thing himſelfe wee bee weake yet mount ſo hygh thus yee ſee god may cōceale ſecrets howbeit knowledge ignorant thing nother bycauſe able ſhe v doth bycauſe able conceyue thing incomprehenſible v nowe v truly wee would knowe permitted v wee well ynough alledge ſome cunning ſhifte deuize many cauſes yet length wee muſt needes confounded owne woordes whereas men ſtreyne themſelues wiſe without following god woorde alwayes ſhewe owne fondneſſe wauering wittes nothing lying vvill wee haue pure cleere vnderſtanding ſpeake god woorks according skill let v come ſchoole let v heare ſpeake let v beare away ſayings ſpecially lette v haue ſuche ſoberneſſe couet knowe ſheweth v vvhen wee come poynt ſhall ſpeake rightly edifying neighbour ſo ſhal bee confirmed paſſe bound god hath ſet v needes gad aſtray wee haue leaue nothing vanitie vntruthe doings thus ye ſee haue remember vpon verſe therefore iob addeth haue ſpoken wist theſe thing mar • elouſe aboue mee haue vnderſtoode thē confirmeth thing ſayd euen iob confeſſeth ſpokē without skil bicauſe vnderstoode thing ſpake ſayeth much ſayd haue put forth ſelf vnaduiſedly bycauſe thoſe thing maruelouſe mee haue knowne heere wee haue marke cauſe iob graunted himſelf ignorant hygheneſſe ſecrets wherof would haue ſpoken god made feele hand yet conceyue cauſe ſhould ſo afflicted therevpon entered theſe deepe tēptations ſay meeneth pinched ſuch extremitie cā god finde hart diſpatch mee hand would fayne deſtroyed mee maketh mee linger peyne knoweth nothing frailtie wretched creature ſuffereth mee ſo long time extremitie wickeddeſt wight world could worſe yet notwithſtanding knoweth haue ſerued vncorruptly ſuch perſone ought ſo caſt frō among men theſe debatings whereinto iob entered preaced farre god ſecrets correct himſelf ſayeth thoſe thing woonderfull therfore let v marke well come vnto god fall talking work ought cō ſider highe ſecrets weake wit reach vnto ſay behoueth v haue ſame perſuaſiō wel god prouidēce general thing belōg ſpiritual kingdome told v god ordereth al thing thing done world without ſecrete behoueth v mark wel although euery man graunt god ſoueraine lord gouerner yet notwithſtāding whē come point▪ thing whiche ſee ſo troubleſome order ceaſſe guided ſecret prouidence god holdeth ſterne aboue turneth thing ſuch end thinketh good wote done cace vve muſt reuerently conſider able moūt vp ſo high ſecret therfore honour god thing know vntil reuele vnto v thing hiddē frō v yet vvere throughly well known theſe dogges barke ſo againſt god prouidēce rayle vpon doctrine cōteyned holie ſcripture wold ſone ceaſſe pratling day certaine drūkards braynleſſe fellowes wil ſay god gouern al thing muſt follow men ſin elſe ſins ought fathered vpō blaſphemies ſhal mā heare bicauſe ſuch naughtipackes cannot finde hart yeeld vnto point god prouidence maner gouerning worlde wonderfull doctrine outreaching capacitie leaue nothing vnto god wil need determine thing owne mind raunging therefore let v marke well iob telleth v heere general principle god work skanning al thing done heere bilowe come queſtiō behoueth v bee alwayes ſo reuerend minded aforehand think heere dungeon deepe v therefore muſt preſume ſpeake owne vnderſtanding ſimply woorſhip god ſober without inquiring ouerfarre meane whyle conclude yet notwithſtanding god guideth al thing nothing commeth paſſe aduenture according hath determined ſame doctrine hath often bene handled large heretofore marke one point ſecond let v learne whatſoeuer thing concerne ſpirituall kingdome god ought taken woonderfull thing aboue v accordingly paule ſpeaketh ſenſuall man ſayeth vnderſtandeth ſecrets god according ſaid benefit god hath prepared aboue choſen ſo excellent eye cā ſee minde man conceyue ſeyng ſo let v learn pray god inlighten v holy ſpirite make v ſtye aboue heauens namely power faith naturall wit neuer atteyne thither haue obteyned may alſo haue foreſayd modeſtie paſsing beyond meaſure faith iob treateth therof anon ye ſee thē firſt point haue mark ſtreyne god work ſpecially promiſes cōcerning euerlaſting welfare cōteyned goſpel wōderfull thing aboue v therfore muſt ſtep raſhly malapertly preſumptuouſly reuerently pray god make v taſte ſecrets ſo farre foorth behoof open thing day day dark v ſuffer v paſſe bound wee may take profit thing ſhall open vnto v tarie increaſing faith ſo let v neuer ſpeake thinke god ſecrets reuerence humilitie furthermore wheras iob confeſſeth ſpake wiſt foraſmuch accuſeth himſelfe raſhneſſe let v alſo learne example cōdemne al talke ſhall haue caſt foorth wee haue bene taught mouth god let v bee aſhamed confeſſe owne follie wee haue ſhewed beaſtlyneſſe ſpeaking without good ground let v clatter whē rebuked ſuch gather poyſon thinke well done go matter ſay tuſh wil neuer ſay otherwiſe ſtil ſame mind let v haue ſuch hardhatedneſſe v wee haue bene ouerbold ſpeaking haſtily ſome wandering woords haue ſcaped v wee wel grounded god truthe let v acknowledge follie renouncing ouerhaſtineſſe ſpeakyng aduenture lette v ſay iob ſpake wist herewithall behoueth alſo bee well aduiſed afterward practize forealledged leſſon beleeuing beyng ſure matter wee ſpeake lette v beware wee beleeue aught whiche god hath ſhewed v wee muſt come poynt fayth grounded vpō woord god holie scripture wiſdome vvhen wee come knowledge▪ may wee ſpeake yea wee may ſpeake thing paſſe vnderſtanding aſmuche god ſhall haue ſhewed v fayth wee haue ſayde afore howbeeit ynough v acknowledge fault muſt alſo reſort remedie hād according iob hath giuen v example therof ſayd put foorth himſelf without vnderſtanding wel ſpake addeth heare wil ſpeak aske thee end thou mayst teache mee heere iob pretēdeth repreſſe himſelf bicauſe ſawe plaid looce colt keeping himſelf within bound confeſsing fault faſhion many men think themſelues quite diſcharged ſaying •• one word haue done amiſſe byandby returne old byaſſe alwaies new begin doth ſo ſayeth lord ſeing hath bene ſuch fooliſh raſhneſſe haue ſo farre ouerſhot ſelf run aſtray poze thou haue bin well taught thy ſchole let ſpeake ſimply thou haſte taught mee let befal mee put foorth thing wherof haue skill effect matter cōteined verſe wheras iob ſayeth heare mee wil ſpeake meening craue audience ſpeake hee liſteth hee done ſo much alredy excuſeth himſelfe ſaying immediatly queſtioning god ſhall taught hand therfore let v mark two faſhions ſpeaking vnto god one mē pleade againſt lay forth interrogatory make obiections thinke themſelues wiſe lewd maner ſpeaking preſume enter ſo diſputation god reply againſt doings let v keepe ourſelues kind ſpeche better tung plucked head although ouercommon vice yet deteſtable vice ſuch one wyſe borne therfore hath bin ſayd afore let v learne keepe mouthes ſhet ſpeak head imaginacions come mind let fall ground wheras ſay lawfull v ſpeak meene behoueth v haue ſtay ourſelues tung alſo al affection able ſo much ſhould ſtill feele ſome tickling luſt deſirouſneſſe ſeeke ſomewhat farre diſputing againſt god bicauſe behoueth v fight againſt beat ſobrietie whervnto behoueth faithful brought goſpel may ſimply giue glorie vnto god cōfeſsing thēſelues know nothing muſt god child practiſe point namely preſume ſpeake ſo randō whatſoeuer thing thinke good another kinde ſpeaking good holie muſt followe inquire god may teache ſee many foade thēſelues beaſtlineſſe mā labour bring thē truthe loth come play brute beaſts might knowe nothing ſo become vtterly dul therfore behoueth v ſpeake howbeit asking counſell god wit deſiring teache v wee haue cōfeſſed haue skill void light reaſon vnderſtanding nothing darkneſſe lying owne wit wee haue confeſſed let v come aske counſel god hand ſaying lord beſech thee voutchſafe ſhew v whatſoeuer good v know neuertheleſſe verily behoueth v euē behalf alſo haue bridle hold v backe elſe might aske god ſhall bee requiſite many men would haue al thing paſſe head peraduenture come vnto god aske hand▪ howe ſuch exceſsiue curioſitie asking neuer ende aske aught god muſt alwayes exception lord ſhew v thing thou knoweſt expedient welfare ſo knowledge may edifying truſting thy goodneſſe feare thy name foraſmuch thou lorde knoweſt ſlenderneſſe ſhewe v thy according abilitie eate honnie doubte ſweete taſte yet notwithſtanding wee ſee man ſhall ſwolne ſweetneſſe go neare make burſt euen ſo v wee ſeke high knowledge ſame wil end turne bitternes vve may beguiled beginning bicauſe ſeeme goodly thing ſuche one wee may attaine knowledge yea let v cōſider hapned father adam would nedes know difference betweene good euill god giuen thereby threw himſelfe headlong dungeon wherein wee yet ſtill day sith ſo let v couet great glorie end wil glorie v salomon ſayth like honnye euen reaſon ſweeteneſſe turneth bitterneſſe man eate much ſo v wee bee inquiſitiue god work lawfull v therefore let v couet know may well away except intēd ouerwhelmed nowe expreſly ſayde heare mee ſpeake aske thee intent bee taught wee come god learne hande behoueth v yeelde ſelues teachable firſt poynt teachableneſſe take mayſter obey fully thing ſhal liſt tech v yong child cōmes firſt ſchoole needes chooze bokes lyking ſay learne ſuch ſcience bee taught ſuche thing ſuch thing haue gone apcee ſo great doctor hee haue meane whereby bee taught come place wher learning pray ſcholerlyke modeſtie ſcholer take man teach ought ſubmitte himſelf wholly ought god vvhat cō pariſon cace lette v marke well deſire vnfainedly taught god wee followe owne luſtes ſay hee ſhould ſhew v whatſoeuer wee haue conceyued owne heade wee holde v contented whiche hee knoweth bee welfare diſcerne belongeth vnto cauſe iob concludeth heeretofore hee hearde ſpeaking god nowe hee hadde ſeene eye hee ſayde lorde true heeretofore haue hearde ſpeaking thy maieſtie nowe knowe another manner ende ſubmitte myſelfe wholly vnto thee iob maketh compariſon heere betweene knowledge hee hadde hadde reuelation wherein god opened himſelfe ſo manyfeſtly vnto hee vtterly abaſhed touched ſuche feare hee coulde doe nothing glorifie god wee ſee hee dothe howbeit ought ſuffyze v haue hearde god ſpoken thereof alſo proceedeth knowledge fayth ſayth saint paule commeth heering fayth bringeth v perfect wiſedome ſayde another place deſire know child god known fayth sainct iohn ſayth canonicall epiſtle agayne paule ſayth firſt corinthian fayth enter god ſecrets yea euē deepeſt ſpirit dwelleth v warrant v thing enter intoo fleſhly vnderſtanding faith proceeding hearing bringeth v true perfection wiſdome therfore ought ſatiſfie v haue heard god ſpoken iob ment betoken knowledge whiche heare ſpeaking thing haue ſeene ſee thing ſurer thē let v mark well iobs meening refuze doctrine wherwith taught god woord preached v v vnderſtād doctrine beate eares dead thing vntill god reuele himſelf ſuch wiſe know eyeſight done dayly goſpell preached muſt god ſpeake v two ſorts ſpeaketh v meanes man whiche appointed miniſter teach v againe ſpeaketh v working ſpirit ſo touched inwardly fare better doctrine haue hart perced without voice vaniſheth away vnprofitable ſound many goſpell ſpeak dayly preached thē grow hardharted ſpoken prophet eſay go people tell ſhall ſee eye heare eares ſhall vnderſtand bicauſe haue hard hart cannot meanes ſoftened vve ſee god worke grace men ſhall alwayes continue ſtubborne therefore god ſpeaketh v muſt bee faine diſcouer ſhewe himſelf v make v ſee bodily ſight perceyuing maieſtie ſuch wiſe wee may learne reuerence put ourſelues wholly hād may haue authoritie dominion ouer v let v fall face good god acknowledgemēt fault praying make v feele end may come true repentance ſuffer dayly calling vppon v well doctrine preached v goſpell correction ſendeth v vnprofitable v wee may learne confirmed feeling ſinnes ſo wee may craue forgiueneſſe hande ſeeke remedie goodneſſe therewithall deſire altogither taught ſchole yeeld ſelues teachable vntoo euen till hee haue rid v ignorance ſtripped v quite cleane vayne truſts wherein wrapped may pleaſe graunt grace onely v c clviij sermon ſecond vpon xlij chapter 6 therfore abhorre repent duſt aſſhes 7 lord ſpoken theſe vvoordes vnto iob ſayd vnto eliphas themanite vvrath kindled againſt thee vpon thy tvvo companion ye haue ſpoken rightly mee hath ſeruant iob 8 therefore take yee ſeuen ox ſeuen ſheepe get ye ſeruant iob offer ſacrifize ſelues ſeruant iob ſhall pray vvill accept face end folly layd charge haue ſpoken rightly concerning mee hath ſeruant iob ſawe yeſterday perceyue god preſence touched glorie bycauſe without impoſsible mē come good order whatſoeuer ſayd vnto eyther play deafe folkes elſe let ſlip ſpoken experience ſheweth much therefore requiſite god ſpeaketh ſhould alſo ſhewe himſelf v giue v ſome liuely perceyuerance maieſtie intent wee may feare cauſe iob proteſteth diſcontented himſelf miſliketh hee ſpoken men neuer vtterly miſlike workes woordes except feele god bee iudge vvee knowe howe euery man giuen ſoothe himſelf fond flatterie eies dazeled none v ſeeth owne ſhame ſee yet doth willingly regard god muſte fayne ſhew himſelf come ſo much reaſon miſlike ourſelues take hold ſhall done fayde v howbeit contrarie part alſo wil colour vice ſeeke excuſes wee haue true repentance rather wee confeſſe wee haue done amiſſe yea euen bee hartely ſorie ſinner returne rightly vnto god onely acknowledge offence yeeld himſelfe giltie alſo condemne himſelf preſuming againſt maker therfore let v marke well true repentance importeth hating ſin yea euen vttermoſt inſomuch man miſliketh hateth himſelf bycauſe ſuch one ought loue god rightuouſneſſe hee condemneth himſelf ſeeketh meanes poſsible vncaced old skin wherin wrapped true trial repentāce herin ſee ſhameleſſe ſay repentant yet man cannot get one woord mouth ſheweth token lowelineſſe ſo farre intending yeeld themſelues whole hart vnto god indeuering make amends offence haue done ſtill maynteyne themſelues wickedneſſe put cace mā acknowledge fault yet nothing worth ſo except vtterly miſlyke hate himſelfe ſayd afore vvherfore one bee well wee ſee mockerie ſay man repentant meane ſeaſon hardharted towardes god ſhameleſſe towardes men nowe iob ſtranger hee neuer churche god ſay corporation chozen linage abraham ſpake maner knew true repentance damnation ſhall lie vpon v ſo brutiſh rude theſe dayes wee wote difference betweene cheef ground faith lo wee haue profited goſpell prophet yea bodie iewes people god choſen viſible churche could skill declare true repentance except men vtterly condemne abace themſelues vice nowadayes wheras thoſe taken chriſtians vſe woord repentance ſtayne vnhallowe leawd filthie mouthes coueting haue men take repentance flat mocking god much behoueth v marke conteyned heere namely intend ſhewe wee truely turned vnto god behoueth v haue eye owne ſhamefulneſſe looke vpon ſuch wiſe v may condemned learne owne iudges ende may quit deſireth nothing pardon ſuch come backe vnto true lowelines iob addeth purpoſely repent duſt aſhes ſhould ſay redie yeeld himſelf wretched offender vnto god mā may well repent without putting ſackloth vpon backe without caſting duſt vpō head neuertheleſſe men old time vſed thoſe ceremony intented make ſolemne proteſtation vtterly cōdemned god remedie thē god ſhould graciouſe thē miſerable offender therfore let v marke well iob ſpeaketh common repentance acknowledgeth offence ſo greuouſe outrageouſe deſerueth well come halter necke ſhew opē ſignes nothing elſe curſedneſſe till god receiue gather home true matter myght bee layd foorth length neuertheleſſe ſuffize v effect aſſhes duſt ſpoken heere cheef poynt repentance outward token furthermore token alwayes requiſite make open proteſtation outrageouſe crime behoueth faithfull wel aduiſed repent miſlike themſelues life long paſſe one day without many miſdooings cōmit infinite fault without knowledge yea euē thinking well ſo examine ourſelues throughly ſhal alwayes find ſomewhat ſtill amiſſe v therfore haue cauſe ſorrowe yet notwithſtanding ſhal neede make open proteſtation men may repentance well without outward ſignes ioyned fault groſſe god wrath ſheweth ſelfe towards v thē muſt ſorie miſlyke ſelues alſo conſideratiō ſame may edifie neighbour muſt adde ſome outward ſignes man haue giuen ſome ſtumbling blocke ſeeth god name blaſphemed god diſcouereth ſhame hee muſt miſlyke hate himſelfe alſo match outward humilitie men record ſeale ratifie repētance muſt euery particular perſone alſo whole people according wee ſee hath alwayes bin practize churche moreouer let v marke wel ynough v haue outward token hart muſt ſpecially wounded throughly greeued prouoking god wrath againſt v may conceyue ſorineſſe condemne ourſelues vtterly diſmayed ourſelues ſorrowe wherof sainct paule ſpeaketh ſayeth muſt ſhun bycauſe ſaluatiō therfore ſayd alſo prophet ioell rend hart garment true vnto ſuch offended greuouſly deſirouſe god ſhould heare prophet giueth commandment returne ſackloth duſt aſſhes confeſſe themſelues offender craue forgiueneſſe declare ſolemne proteſtation haue deſerued death haue pitie thē howbeit foraſmuchas men ſo ſore inclyned hypocriſie wil needes content god fayre contenāces forget ought firſt cheef point prophet ſayeth expreſly hart muſt rent hardneſſe muſt put away wee ſee effect iob ment ſay repenting vnaduized ſpeeche hee addeth ſo light ſmall ſin ſo heynouſe hee readye ſhewe himſelfe wretched offender committed crime woorthie death hath none hope refuge mere mercie god yea euen make ſame proteſtation willingly men end ſuch haue bene offended may ſet vp againe men knowe deſireth nothing humble himſelfe vnder god hand ſeing ſo ſide haue doone fault let v learne leſſen hyde acknowledge yea euen vtter abacing ourſelues againe haue begonne miſlyke ſinnes hart iothe ſorie thē end god ſhould enter account v let v alſo haue modeſtie men vſe proteſtations god liketh namely confeſſe reſpects haue deſerued death god admit v mercie let ſhame ſin hinder v making amends offence whiche wee haue giuen dooing amiſſe herevpon ſayde god ſpoken vnto iob turned himſelfe eliphas themanite ſayd vnto wrath kindled thee thy companion yee haue ſpoken rightly mee ſeruant iob hath done vvee haue ſeene heretofore god found fault iob nowe ſecondarily findeth fault companion yea much roughly come compariſon made betwene iob freends wee haue marke order ſayd god hauing ſpoken thoſe woordes vnto iob turned talke thoſe wrongfully condemned hereby warned although god chaſtize fatherly gē tleneſſe yet notwithſtanding hee executeth iuſtice throughly vpon according ſayd puniſhments chaſtizements begin owne houſe churche yee ſee god rebuketh iob meane whyle letteth alone whiche offended groſſely mā might demād yea ſo vvhy doeth god ſet himſelfe alonly iob partie leaſt offended although done fault yet bee borne withall fault companion yet god ſeemeth vtter rigour againſt alone lo man might ſay howbeit rebuked firſt bycauſe thing haue alledged prophet muſt ſulfilled wit god beginneth chaſtize houſeholdfolke firſt vvhen intendeth execute iuſtice beginneth vnbeleeuers letteth thē alone ſpareth though forgotten fault throughly recorded ſhall come account ſuffereth ſins thoſe loueth ripe yea rotte yea meane chaſtizeth thoſe whō hath adopted auoweth child ſheweth ſignes roughneſſe whyle thoſe ſtrangers take reſt welter eaſe pleaſures thus ye ſee ſhewed v text verie profitable leſſon v wee ſee dayly ſtate faithfull miſerable ſtate deſpiſers god godly ſeeme vtterly forſaken drag wing thē pine away world meane whyle wicked ſet vp creſts merrie make iolly chere euen skorne god would trouble men ſee theſe thing wee doctrine iudgement beginneth god owne houſe according alſo ſayd prophete eſay god ſhall haue finiſhed woork vpon mount sion ſpare wicked prophet ſayeth purpoſely god muſt performe al correction church forſomuch owne thoſe hee ſetteth moſte ſtore therefore muſt viſit firſt clenze thē ſinnes reforme may bring thē home himſelfe muſt one day away till haue made end whole woorke thē horrible vengeāce prepared thoſe abuſed patience hardened harte whyles bare thē peter alſo warneth v ala freends ſayeth let v bee greeued child world god letteth alone peace wee meane chaſtized hand ſo ſtate hard troubleſome beare let v beare paciently ſayeth ſeyng wee muſte bee faine paſſe furnace bee tried maner ſhall become thoſe god hath vtterly forſaken let v acknowledge goodneſſe god according alſo prophet ſayeth thoſe whō god hath long borne likened frutes reſerued ende yeere good rotten ſuch gathered ſooner ſhal neuertheleſſe eaten men ſhall honour notwithſtā ding gathered ſo let v learne god procureth furthereth welfare pleaſeth chaſtize v firſt al others wicked giue themſelues making good cheere howbeit wee cannot ſay eliphas companion vtterly reiected god contrariwiſe hee accepted yet alienated tyme iob muſt faine meane elſe ſhall find meanes fauour forgiueneſſe compare iob wee ſay one houſehold church others yee would ſay baniſhed time till god haue reconciled yet ye ſee iob rebuked meane god ſpeaketh woord others therfore let v conſider haue erſt ſayd god loueth v haſtie viſiting v hee ſeeth haue ſtepped awrie gone right way ſaluation watcheth ouer v bring v home againe ſpeede let v come compariſon ſet downe heere betweene iob freends ſayd iob ſpake rightly god howe god notwithſtanding condemned ignorant ouerweening vnpacient perſone ſayd rightneſſe haue told heretofore iob vndertakē good cace howbe proceeded amiſſe iob therefore ouerſhot himſelfe following matter yet cace good ſtil cōrrariwiſe iobs freends vſed goodly reaſons ſuch wee haue gathered holie doctrine yet ground worke euil tooke general ground quite beſides cace iob puniſhed miſdeeds taken wicked curſed creature ſeing god vſed ſuch rigour towards furthermore alſo ſet downe falſe vntoward doctrine ſaying god doth euen world hādle mē according deſerts much take away hope euerlaſting life ſhet fauorableneſſe god frayle tranſitorie life turning al thing vpſide downe therefore behoueth v call theſe twoo point remembrance wee may knowe ryghtneſſe ſpokē ſhort wee muſt note text haue alledged pſalm heretofore namely man bliſſed iudgeth diſcretly poore aduerſitie prophete ſheweth v wee ſee man aduerſitie god wee ſhould haue diſcreetneſſe condemne firſt daſh looke vp hygher wit conſider aduerſities ſometimes befall men chaſtizement ſinnes ſometyme tryall pacience ſometime preuent ſome fault might fall alſo god ſetteth thē foorth mirrours end ſeing obedience might edified therby ſometymes ſome ſecret cauſes vnknowne v therfore let v eſchew raſhneſſe wee ſee god afflict man roughly let v ſwift iudgemēt ſay woorthie ſo handled commend ſuch liue eaſe though better beloued god vnaduiſed iudging ſo haue diſcretion v conſider cauſes noted v ſcripture ſhall find diuerſe time ſuch excellent ſeruants god handled moſte rigorouſly ſeeme v god againſt wee muſte iudge owne fancie wee vſe modeſtie god alwayes ſuccour v wee afflicted cruell fooliſhe giuing haſtie ſentence like meaſure muſt bee moten vnto v alſo furthermore better vnderſtanding whiche ſayde heere namely iob hath ſpoken ryghtly friendes amiſſe behoueth v take generall rule man forewardneſſe followe god feare ſame ſhal accepted notwithſtāding commit groſſe fault whereas another man haue true feare god rooted although haue apparant vertues commendable men yet nothing worth ſtarke filth looke ſay vpon man feareth god rightly purely mynded giue himſelfe welldoing yet notwithſtanding ſhall haue many infirmity hee halteth ſtaggereth reeleth yea ſometimes falleth flat downe yea faultes hee doth forgiuen god doth ſtill reach hande lifte vp inſomuch falleth benefite bycauſe marke aimeth goe vnto god minde leadeth ſtill thytherward contrarie parte maye come paſſe ſayde man ſhall bee greatly commended hee ſhall haue goodly vertues ſhall doe thing worthy honor yet meane hath good roote eyther deſpyzer god vnmercifull towards neyghbors mā bee ſuch one none thing men honor cā pleaſe god hereby may vnderſtand taking iob iob haue erſt ſaid al life long bin giuē weldoing bene ryghtuouſe man one feared god yea ſayd ſingleneſſe hart purpoſely attributed vnto heretofore ſhewe life ſhal neuer wel ruled till cleane rid faynedneſſe walke ſight god men doubleminded ſubſtantially grounded giue ourſelues wholly vnto god hath bin ſpoken expreſly iob cōcerning preſent cace indured afflictiō patiently neuertheleſſe end tormented extremitie hee fretted thafed ſpecially men fell ſtinging forgate ouerſhot himſelf ſeeming minded reſiſt god ſcaped frō many vnaduiſed word iobs fault theſe pacience hilde ought haue done playd fole talk namely ſome particular ſayings yet kept ſtil marke ſpake beginning howſoeuer ſwarue aſide yet flingeth quite away holdeth race though go altogither rightforth like archer ſhooting mark although hit whyte full yet men ſee amed well hee ſhoote ſomewhat neere euen ſo ſtoode cace iob cauſe god attributeth rightneſſe vnto let v learne haue pure holie intent ſeeke earneſtly good although weake although wrapped many vice although happen ſtagger fall although effect deſerue forſaken god yet notwithſtanding hee beareth v hath eye infirmity vice cōdemne without forgiueneſſe cauſe ſayd ſcripture ſuch giue thēſe lues ſeruing god keping law rightuouſe maner zacharie elizabeth ryghtuouſe god rightuouſe ſuch mā found ſayd pſalme muſt v need condēned wretched ſinners v haue mouthes ſtopped yes verely howbeeit beſides god receyued zacharie elizabeth gouerne thē holie ſpirit alſo accept deſirouſeneſſe wel nothing perfectiō deſires vtterly vnperfect obedience ſuch ought yet doth god accept good woorth bycauſe men earneſtly deſirous ſerue hee layeth imperfection charge thus ye ſee accepteth rightuouſe although fault v yet god forgiue ſhall buried mercie ſo faile take v iuſt rightuouſe ſo hart bend thitherward honour giue ourſelues wholly obedience ſayd afore ought ſerue v vnto two purpoſes ſee firſt al papiſts witts take theſe text ground merit vpon ſay behold heere mention made rightneſſe ergo deſerue godward haue pure right hart come vnto ala wherof commeth rightneſſe deſerue ſuch cōmendacion mouth god might alſo condemne v hundredthouſand tymes without ſhewing v fauour howbeeit foraſmuchas hee wypeth fault forgetteth thē intēdeth haue regard therfore accepteth v rightuouſe therfore cace let v acknowledge mere mercie goodneſſe let v honour ſame furthermore ſeing ſayd lord cōtented v accepteth thing good cōmendable notwithſtanding defiled although much amiſſe many great fault imperfectiōs work deſerue abhorred god bicauſe bring nothing filthineſſe yet notwithſtanding accepteth receiueth thoſe work ſo ſtained vice ſacrifiſe ſweete ſent ought take corage well ſeing ſo ought inflamed ſerue honour ye ſee haue mark verſe way let v mark alſo may well heroical act men terme behaue ourſelues vertuouſly courteouſly deuized men may carie v vpō ſhoulders yet ſhal nothing except wee haue liuely roote hart deſirouſe ſerue god mark haue taken ſhoote much better go right way limping make greate leapes yet neuer foreward yea make great ſhewes meane whyle haue hart ſnarled wicked affection let v beware wee couet prayſed much men let v alway come vnder gouernance lord may hold brydle ouer v bethinke v giue ourſelues obediētly way haue ſure infallible record thing hath bin treated although iob fayled ſome point yet ceaſſed haue good cace ſeing god cōpetēt iudge therof auoweth ſo cōtrarie part although frends faire colour reaſons fauorable ſeeming yet miſliked haue ſhewed two reaſons wherof one condemned iob bicauſe ſtrikē god hand wil haue iudgement reuerſed aboue let v learne leaue iudging aduenture god chaſtizeth men let v cōſider wel cauſes conteyned holie ſcripture let v towards neyghbours alſo towards ourſelues doth god afflict v let v wiſe according alſo whē iames ſpeaketh patiēce purpoſely termeth wiſdome ſurely greteſt wiſdome haue knowe god father haue receiued grace hee offereth v lord ieſuschriſt cā take afflictiōs meekly ſendeth v bowing downe ſhoulders vnder thē fal cōforting ourſelues miſeries cheering vp ourſelues ſorrowes way v rightly taught ſchole god whē ſoeuer god ſcourgeth v let v cōceiue hartburning bitterneſſe againſt ſhall gayne nothing rather let v beare mind holy ſcripture ſheweth v namely needfull v bee mortified bicauſe much giuē world loth think vpō heauenly life deſires plight ſhould yet moreouer god knoweth many ſecret rebellion fleſh therfore neede bee ſubdued mayne hand againe wee ſhould know obey ſhuld handle v always liking eaſe therefore faine chaſtiſe v play rough play v howbeit therin procureth welfare trying v ſending v rough troubleſome thing wee grudge againſt thoſe time thē obediēce well allowed thing haue mark iudge diſcretly afflictiōs god ſendeth v likewiſe neighbour ſhall haue ſaid rightnes wherof god beareth witneſſe heere owne mouth cōcluſiō ſaid god ſendeth eliphas cōpanions vnto iob cōmaundeth thē offer ſacrifices ſayth iob ſhal find grace end ſinnes may forgiuen heere firſt haue marke although god rebuke eliphas companion maner yet woulde driue quite away although condemnation pronounced vpon yet ende ſhoulde ſuffer ſo ſhould lie ſtill vtterly throwne downe without remiſsion two ſortes condemnation god pronounceth vppon men thoſe two firſt may alſo deuided intoo two generally god condemneth v either ende acquit v hee ſhall haue found v humbled elſe deſtroy v vtterly doth vnbeleeuers yet notwithſtanding two ſortes condemnation welfare one ſuch alreadie faythfull god chaſtizeth dayly although god account v houſholde wee bee fully reconciled yet haue neede condemned ſtirred vp thereby continually wee may aſhamed ſelues bee ſorie hate ſinnes ſeeke remedie end magnifie mercie hee ſheweth v wee obtayne forgiueneſſe hand thus ye ſee condemnation god layeth vpon choſen notwithſtanding one hath taken flocke yet another condemnation healthfull alſo ſuch ſort ſtraungers god church haue none acquaintance according ſee hee condemned saint paule ſuch tyme hee perſecuter euen perſon saint paule wee may better vnderſtande thing intende ſay ſhoulde alledge twoo ſeuerall perſons thing woulde ſo eaſie vnderſtood beholde saint paule ſo wicked man yee woulde haue thought bene vtterly paſt recouerie yet one god choſen hee marked afore hande mother wombe apoſtle yet notwithſtanding hee ſeemed bee god church rather vtter enimie neuerthelater god condemned beate downe ridde pride wherewith inflamed made cace poore ſlaue burthen verie heauie condemnation yea yet welfare meete ſame pride ſhoulde bee ſubdued beaten downe force ye ſee healthfull condemnation yet man vtterly eſtraunged god ſeemed bee quite paſt hope recouerie nowe saint paule condemned faſhion thereby brought folde god flocke ſo became ſheepe yea therwithall alſo ſhepheard onely one lambes ieſus chriſt alſo ſhephearde flocke yet behoued condemned againe howe god buffeted hee ſayeth god gaue satan leaue giue hym buffet way reproche intent hee ſhoulde exalt himſelfe reaſon highneſſe reuelations god giuen behoued haue counterpoyſon driue poyſon pryde keepe thus wee ſee saint paules perſon twoo maners condemning welfare vvee ſee like preſent place iobs freendes bee condemned owne ſaluation thereby god openeth gate ſheweth maye hope pardon come true repentance yet doth draw backe ſo hee commeth familiarly vnto iob neither graunteth acceſſe entrance vntoo meane expreſſed heere wit iob ſhoulde make interceſsion heere therefore wee ſee two diuerſe example god mercie although handle men diuerſe faſhions yet muſt wee alwayes conſider hee procureth welfare thoſe hath vtterly forſaken thereby taught take correction paciently whiche god ſendeth although ſeeme handle v child take v ſtraungers yet let v ceaſſe hope pitie v length turne condemnation whiche wee ſhall haue indured time benefite ſoulehealth although wee cannot lay forth ſpoken heere concerning sacrifizes yet muſt wee note one worde god time receyued men mercie without ſacrifices betoken obteyn forgiueneſſe ſinnes wee muſt haue recourſe sacrifice offered vp redemption ſo long ieſus chriſt meane betweene god v muſt continue accurſed forlotne hopeleſſe beholde god welſpring righteouſneſſe ſheweth himſelf enimie ſinne ſin dwelleth v therefore muſt god needes open warre v vengeance muſt light vpon v yea tarye vpon v euer ſhift ſcape reſorting sacrifize whereby wee haue beene reconcyled vnto therefore let v marke wee bee ſo much leſſe excuſed nowadayes chriſt hath ſuffered death paſsion thinke quit god meane clenſing chriſt hath made cauſe hee hath made ſatisfaction v diſcharge v condemnation death wherein ſeeke obteyne mercie haue need onely meanes wherby v come vnto god wee muſt alwayes beare minde death paſsion lorde ieſus chriſt ſacrifize redemption attonement vvhen go way woorke let v doubt inaſmuch lorde hath ſhewed himſelfe pitiful towarde ſuch offended time figure lawe yea extended mercie thoſe bodie peculiar people hee alſo receyue v day ſeeing goſpell publiſhed thorow whole worlde hath made common league well gentile iewes ſo wal put difference betwixt let v doubt ſay haue recourſe vnto god meanes ſayd sacrifice preuent v intent hauing obteyned fauor hande may aſſured ſaluation let v fall downe face good god acknowledgement fault praying clenze v whenſoeuer bee rebuked therwithall make v feele fatherly goodneſſe ſoo wee may haue whereof take comfort aduerſityes bee greeued though hee beginne chaſtize v meane ſpare wretched vnbeleeuers knowing meanes hee declareth v ſeeing hath choſen v himſelfe hee haue v •• riſhe therefore let v pray hee ſuffer roddes vnprofitable v ſo ſhoulde abyde ſtill hardened oure ſinnes hee wyll drawe v throughly wee may lowlineſſe acknowledge ſinnes bee ſorie heartes yea alſo proteſt men much bound vnto mercie ende neighbor may edified v one v draw another glorifying whole life hereof may pleaſe ſtirre vp true c clix sermon thirde vpon xlij chapter sermon yet ſtill vpon eight verſe vpon text inſuing 9 eliphas themanite baldad suhite sophar naamathite vvent god commaunded lorde receyued face iob 10 lorde turned captiuitie iob vvhen prayed freends bliſsed latter ſtate iob firſt 11 brother ſiſters came vnto bin acquaintance vvith houſe compaſsion comforted aduerſitie lord cauſed come vpon receiued eche peece ſiluer ech ornament golde 12 lorde bliſſed latter ſtate iob firſt inſomuch hee xiiij thouſand ſheepe ſix thouſand camel thouſand yoke ox thouſand sheeaſſes 13 alſo ſeuen ſonnes three daughter 14 called name one iemima name another kezia name thirde kerenhapuk 15 vvere founde fairer vvomen countrey iobs daughter father gaue heritance among brother 16 theſe thing iob liued hundred forrie yeares ſavv ſonnes ſonnes vnto fourth generation 17 died aged full ſatiſfied vvith dayes wee haue ſeene howe god rebuking iobs freends would leaue hopeleſſe called repentance telling hee woulde heare haue pitie vpon ſo ye ſee correction profitable v god ſhetteth gate agaynſt v ſheweth v readie receyue v mercie otherwiſe ſhould boot v cōuicted ſinnes vve ſhould drowned diſpaire toke hold god mercie ſo ſhoulde wee neuer bee touched true earneſtneſſe repent v euill doings rather wexe hardhearted ſo ſhould chafe vpon brydle ſhould none amendment v therfore let v marke well god worketh men ſingular benefite cauſing thē feele theyr owne naughtineſſe ſheweth yet notwithſtanding ſhal obteyne fauour ſeeke heerewithal haue ſeene alſo god commaunded thoſe men bring ſacrifices iob end ſhould pray humble although god ſhewe himſelfe gentle welminded towardes v yet haue neede ſhould partly ſhew himſelfe hard intreated v yea make v haue diſliking ſinnes oftentimes ſeemeth ſufficient v haue giuē one good ſigh away commonly ſay tongue ſo dally god repentance ought make v vtterly diſmayd ought ſttike v feare whē conſider god wrath able ouerwhelme v vtterly vve thinke vpon wee paſſe ouer wee would paſſe ouer whote burning cole ſay reſpect good profitable v lorde ſhould reine v ſhort ſhew v yet ſtill ſome naughtineſſe lurking v ſtandeth v hande perceyue better god afoording ſo large penywoorthes mercie vnto men intent ſhould alwayes bee humbled cal mind fault haue committed therfore reaſon ſaid text iob ſhould pray thoſe offended yet notwithſtanding doubted well ſacrifices iobs perſon god ment ſhewe men haue neede ſome meane mediator make way cauſe finde fauour according ſee law god ordeyned high prieſt enter alone sanctuarie name people men elſe ſhould ſtande aloofe acknowledging themſelues vnworthie preace neere preſence god betoken without mediator go vnto god oure behalfe ſhoulde neuer bee lawfull v pray vntoo good right alſo wee ſhoulde bee hilde ſcorne ſhette nowe iob hilde heere roome office preeſt hee made interceſſion frendes hee toke vpon owne head beene great preſumptiō behoued ſewe vnto god mennes pardon yet could hee himſelfe come thither withoute mediator aduocate howe coulde haue obteyned grace reſt god inioined charge ſo touching preſent act god appoynted iob preeſt behoued ſo apoſtle ſayeth man ought take honour vppon ſauing appoynted god ſuch one true lawfull preeſt like ieſus chriſt himſelfe thoughe hee bee mayſter churche heade men angelles ſitteth glorie god father yet notwithſtanding thruſt himſelfe called therevntoo
