ſolemne othe ſayde haue ſworne repent thou art preeſt euer order melchiſedecke thē let v marke wel whereas iob ſet foorth preeſt ende wee ſhould gather thereof whenſoeuer haue ſeeke forgiueneſſe ſins euery v muſt thruſt forth himſelfe without hauing better meane conſider office ieſus chriſt giue v acceſſe open v gate bring v preſence god father end may herd throne maieſtie may terrible amyable v done time lawe yea euen among thoſe whome god communicated himſelfe ſo familiarly ſhall theſe dayes wee haue full declaration ieſus chriſt aduocate maketh interceſsion v intent ſutes may well receyued heerein appeareth vnthankefulneſſe worlde hath beene cauſe ſeeking ſo many aduocates patrones euery man hath ſeuerall deuotion bring himſelfe vnto god bycauſe men haue knowne office lorde ieſus chriſt let v marke whenſoeuer v offendeth hee muſt ſteppe raſhly heauenly throne come thither meanes appoynted purpoſe ſure god ſhake v haue promiſe whiche cannot deceyue v wee come thither geeriſhly aduenture ſhall boote v awhitte like cace sacrifice ſpoken heere prayer neuer heard without sacrifice god intended ſhewe good right men vnworthie come vnto bycauſe haue deſerued death fore cōming thither ſhuld deſtruction therfore euer minded obteyne fauour haue brought ſome sacrifice cōfeſſe daunger god iudgement could deliuered otherwiſe sacrifice verie heathen men haue alſo followed ſame vnderſtode ende therfore onely witneſſe agaynſt themſelues neuertheleſſe god leaue preſident whole world mē ſhould acknowledge nothing damnatiō themſelues could ridde except ſinnes blotted making ſome amēdes nowe haue truth reueled vnto v goſpell oft pray god wee muſt haue recourſe death paſsion oure lorde ieſus chriſt cannot otherwiſe reconciled vnto therefore prayer muſt beſprinckled bloud ſhed waſh away ſpottes thus ye ſehow may become acceptable god notwithſtāding good right mortall enimie haue made warre vnto ſo vengeance curſe lie vpon v wit cōming vnto sacrifice offered lorde ieſus chriſt applying ſame vſe intent prayer may bliſſed throughly accepted god hee faile receyue v intoo fauour howbeeit noted whereas god ſayth end follie vntoo ſo worde worde text maner ſpeech woulde bee ſomewhat hardeſt wee marke written eightenth pſalme wee ſhall haue plaine eaſie declaration ſaying ſayde god handle men according hee findeth vvith frowarde ſayeth hee deale frowardly may ſeeme verie ſtraunge neuertheleſſe proueth god chaungeth purpoſe like vntoo v onely importeth wee ſhall finde god bee rough ryder rough horſe prouerbe ſayth bee ſtubborne ſtiffenecked ſo wee bowe god come vppon v maine blowes beetle might ſeeme vntoo v god terrible feerce according therefore wee finde god bee wee conceyue bee fancy hee ſtryketh vppon v ſuch one hee ſayde bee althoughe chaunge light vppon maieſtie muche ſayde text ſayde ende doo follie thoughe lorde ſhoulde ſay ende handle according follie frowardneſſe woorde importeth alſo intent execute vengeance vpon ſay intent handle ſuche faſhion haue deſerued looke ye go ſeruant iob according haue ſayde alreadie namely foraſmuch iobs freends hauing knowledge offence yet ſufficiently ſubdeued god faine diſcouer ſhame make perceyue hee ſhoulde handle worthie woulde terrible dealing therefore iob came meane betwixt prayer woulde one therewithall obedience declared god commaunded heerein ſee howe men chaunged god ſpeaketh effectually making thē heare voyce eares alſo making receyue hart time iobs frends taken reprobate gaue iudgement vpon without admitting excuce ſpake luſtily agaynſt though bin ſome ſillie worme earth ſome vyler thing worme nowe come yea euen intreatance god hath bereft pryde blinded lo chaunge followeth humbled god hath ſo ſpoken heart knowe wee bee nothing keepeth v walking feare frō vtter abacing ourſelues bee ſotted fooliſh ouerweening thinke ſelues therfore god muſt faine teach v men worlde cannot mend fooliſhe pride wherewith puffed vp till god haue put hande beſides iobs freendes forgotten pride wherewith erewhyles beene caried away alſo ſhewe theyr repentance obeying god verie deede true frute ſheweth roote good otherwiſe ſhould lie hidde heart indeuer obey god ordinaunce alſo cauſe ſayde actes men brother ſhall wee doo vvhen saint peter thūdered agaynſt thoſe erewhyles deſpyſed oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſayde beeing wounded theyr heartes pricked inwardly remorſe ſaid ſhal offered themſelues vnto god followe whatſoeuer ſhoulde commaunde therfore wee ſee like frute repentance text iobs freends vpon knowledge putting away fonde ouerweening wherwith bene hild come god willed thē ſo whenſoeuer wee bee throughly humbled god ſo diſpleaſed ſelues ſhal alſo haue willingneſſe deſire ſubmit ſelues god woorde one peece ouerweening thing haue ymagined owne braine wee needes bee ouerwiſe wee cannot obey god vtterly bereft pride know god ought haue authoritie tel v good v doo nothing elſe v doo ſubmit ſelues without gainſaying nowe added immediately god receyued face iob turned captiuitie turned repentance prayed freends seeing ſo god regarded face iob accepted prayer forſomuch appoynted bee pr • eſt pray haue wee much better certentie ſeeing euerlaſting aduocate entered sanctuarie heauen wit lorde ieſus chriſt ſhall neuer refuzed wee neyther come god hys father meanes holding euermore way furtherance hee hath giuen v beholde iob poore man euen entering high way blaſpheme god although hee holde himſelfe pacience winding vp yet ſuch pangues made fling ouer feeldes ſomuch • fended god greeuouſly haue declared heeretofore yet god inioyned office praying heard onely himſelfe alſo ſtraungers yea ſuche bene enemy good well neere ſeparated frō god vtterly peruerted woorde beaten downe deſtroyed hope endleſſe lyfe come haue ſayde afore yet notwithſtanding iob obteyneth grace nowe ſayde god made thing auaylable little dimme ſhadowe ſhall bee done nowe hee hath appoynted owne onely ſonne bee prieſt commaunded offer vp goates calues sheepe offer vp bodie ſoule sacrifice seeing sonne god hath owne perſon offered himſelfe redemption away ſinnes ceaſſeth make interceſsion v ſtill ſhoulde wee doubt obteyning forgiueneſſe ſake beeing alwaies receyued louingneſſe fauour god hande haue touched alreadie naughtyneſſe worlde ſheweth ſelfe men content themſelues one mediatour alone papiſts runne ſeeking hee ſaincts sheeſaincts bee patrones aduocates cauſe thereof yeeld ſo muche woorſhip vnto ieſus chriſt acknowledge hath bought deathe paſsion well ynough call sonne god redeemer acknowledge aduocate neyther flee ſuccour know pray heare tydings among ſide dutie becommeth v ſpeake thoſe duely taught oft wee ſhoulde pray vnto god euerlaſting sacrifice wherby redemption hath bene purchaſed v ought come remembrance eye wee neuer thinke vppon glaunce many ſo groſſe beaſtly although ought haue eares deafe hearing ieſus chriſte aduocate yet diſcerrie betweene god lord ieſus chriſt ſomuch ſhoulde call vpon father name lorde ieſus chriſte wote whither bee aduocate maketh interceſsion v maruell though lorde oftentimes ſo dazle men eye end turne away meane furtherance whiche hath giuen worde turned away maliciouſneſſe haue ſhet gate againſt themſelues might haue none acceſſe vnto god call vpon according alſo know opening except wee haue ieſus chriſte ſpokeſman whome haue forſaken bicauſe diuell hath time ſo laboured put forth fonde imagination carie away men hither thither let v keepe ſelues gadding rather ſith ſee god hath heard men meanes sacrifice ſo prieſtes law entered vaine sāctuarie made man hand corruptible brought better thing bloud beaſt let v ſure nowe lord ieſus chriſt make v find god pitifull fauourable towards v ſo ſhal receiued mercie doubtleſſe prayer grounded vpon sacrifice hee hath offered acknowledge belongeth carie worde v cauſe v heard heerewithall haue alſo marke ſayd heere god made iobs captiuitie tuine turned repentance ſo may woordes bee taken playneſt tranſlation turned iobs captiuitie ſo anguiſh wherein taken away elſe captiuitie ſay cattell ſubſtance bene taken away reſtored againe howſoeuer betokeneth end god pitie vpon ſeruant yea purpoſely expreſſed haue come paſſe iob prayed freindes ſay thoſe perſecuted wee haue ſeene afore herein ſee wee loue enimies procure welfare ſaluation ſhall owne benefite profite god make bleſsing returne vppon v vvee bee diuerſe time afrayde leaſt wee ſhould bee gentle kinde hearted men haue offended v diueliſh prouerb man play ſheepe woolfe eate vp muche practiſed cauſe wee bee ſo wedded owne reuenge men haue troubled v done v wrong ſeemeth v forgiuing wee layde open reproche enimies take boldneſſe agaynſt v behoueth v let thoſe fancy go god hath taken charge v himſelfe hath giuen v good shephearde euen lorde ieſus chriſt hath promiſed keepe v furthermore let v marke well wee pray ſuch vexe v ſame bliſsing light vpon v pleaſe god take place verie well whereas enimies ſhall bee brother continue wilfull malice yet lorde make requeſtes redounde ſelues ſhal haue made thē thus ye ſee purpoſely ſayd god looked mercifully vpon iob whē prayed thoſe ſo miſvſed haue ſeene ſo behoueth v call mind iames ſaith haue heard paciēce iob ſeene ende iſſue god gaue ſheweth v afflictiōs god ſendeth vpō child laſte ende right happie ſo farre better ſo afflicted time liue alwayes eaſe god ſhould ſpare much mā would fall aſleepe world vve ſhould knowe obedience luſtes fleſh would play reſlife iades wee would thinke vpon nothing preſent tranſitorie life therefore let v vnderſtande god afflicteth faythfull one firſt purpoſe preſſe vttermoſte hee knoweth bee able beare sainct paule ſayeth accordingly foraſmuche god faythfull ſuffer v bee tempted beyonde able beare furthermore ſheweth ende haue cauſe wiſhe ſo beaten god ſcourges according dauid ſaith lorde good thou didſt chaſtiſe inſomuch may alwaies glorie aduerſities correction thing whiche behoueth v marke ſtreyne iobs ſake written god bliſſed latter ſtate hys firſt hee doubled goodes ſubſtance whiche verie great afore hee gaue ſonnes daughter lengthued life ſo ſaw child came owne race vnto fourth generation ſeene himſelfe ſo lowe ebbe true holy ghoſt ment leaue memoriall gracious goodneſſe god ſhewed vpon perſon iob howbeit inſtruction without cauſe saint iames hath ſet v downe ſelfeſame mirrour ſaying freends true hard troubleſome thing kepepacience men tormented agaynſt nature howbeit ende god turneth thing ſuch wiſe welfare perceyue much better haue beene ſo afflicted haue beene much tenderly borne withall cockered ſhort whē ſoeuer troubled aduerſitie meane onely b •• alſo haue ſuch hartbytings ſet v chafe tempt v diſpayre carpe againſt god let v bethink v thing haue read iob pacience wee compare aduerſities aduerſities able beare wee ſhall certenly finde god ment ſet mirrour paſſed temptation trouble dayly befall godly see iob one ſide ſpoyled ſubſtance hee beene rich prince countrey vtterly bereft thing hath neither houſe thing elſe left beſides yee ſee alſo bereft child hys wife ſpyted agaynſt bodie behold rotten carion ſuch one men would bee loth looke vpon according wee haue ſeene complaine skinne cleaued bone yea hath beene ſayd ſcraped rottenneſſe fleſhe potſherd terrible ſight yet thing iob ſuffered bothe goodes child wife hys bodie cheefe thing indured thoſe nothing compariſon anguiſhe hee abode hee ſawe god agaynſt alſo thing whereat hee greeued hee made complaintes ſaying vvhat nowe vvhy doth god take away vvhy raced worlde muſt ſinger heere ſort ſeeing poore frayle creature doth god preſſe ſo greeuouſly iob great trouble ſaw god aduerſarie partie ſide wiſt ſeeing ſo muſt greeue v wee bee meanly afflicted god chaſtice v according infirmitie euerie man owne behalfe wee muſt thinke ſtraunge let v reſort ſtorie written learning therevpon haue eye ende wee looke extremitie wherein iob time god perſecuted ala wee ſhall bee vtterly diſmayde none v hee ſhall vtterly quayle ſaying vvhat booteth man ſerue god ſeeing ſuche haue walked feare moſt vnfortunate looke vpon ende thing wherein haue wherewith comfort ſelues namely firſt haue ſayde bycauſe affliction god child laſt ſecondly ſerue ſalues medicine moreouer end thē alwayes happie inſomuch haue euer cauſe glorifie god onely hee deliuereth alſo bycauſe hee mortifyeth wicked luſtes alſo therein haue better confirmation doctrine whereas lorde ieſus chriſt liuely image faythfull child god bee made conformable saint paule declareth eight romaynes aduerſities wee ſhaped like image lord ieſus chriſt eldeſt ſonne houſe god truely looke onely vpon croſſe ieſus chriſt curſed god owne mouth ſhall ſee nothing ſhame terrour ſhort ſeeme verie gulfe hell open ſwallow vp ieſus chriſt whē ioyne reſurrection death behold wherwith comfort v beholde wherewith aſſwage ſorrowes ende ouerſorowfull whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god afflict v purpoſely fulfilled lord ieſus chriſt intent ſhould knowe written one perſon onely intent v ſhould vnderſtand ſonne god make v partaker lyfe die partaker glorie wee beare ſhames aduerſities ſhall pleaſe god lay vpon ſhoulders according alſo paule ſpeakecth another place vve ſee cauſe reherced v ſhould bee vtterly diſmayde wee ſee god afflicteth v conceyue ſuch ſorow ſhould ſhet vp hart hold v priſoners ſo might receiue comfort wee ſhould alwayes haue eye end god hath promiſed child according hath ſhewed effect well iob alſo dauid others cheeflyeſt lorde ieſus chriſt true cheefe patterne faithfull true doth cōmonly fal god doubleth benefites towardes ſuch haue beene afflicted ſo may ſeene farre rycher haue child ofſpring ••• deſired worldwarde alwayes ſeene god handleth v one egall rate kn • weth fitte euery man behoueth v frame ſelues receyue portion ſuche wiſe ſhall pleaſe deale vnto v houſeholders hande knoweth well meete houſehold howſoeuer worlde go behoueth v take generall rule god onely bring affliction ende alſo make turne welfare ſo wee ſhall perceyue forgat v ſuch time hee afflicted v rather 〈…〉 wed himſelfe continually father towardes v ſuffered v fall faſt aſleepe worlde temporall bliſings well may wee take alſo god ſendeth howbeit let v haue eye principall nothing elſe bee confirmed god goodneſſe wee haue • e greater aſſurance ayde fayth alwayes exerciſed bee afflicted verie much man ſcarce knew auaylable god fauor helpe v need doth affliction ſee god ſtrengthneth ſuch wiſe holy ſpirite beareth affliction meekly whē deliuered knoweth god put hand thervpon gathereth ſeeing god hath aſsiſted one brūt wil neuer faile none thing one ſide ſee helpe god giueth v ſecondly worketh v holy ſpirit intent ſhould quaile finally ſheweth v experience redy help v al time ſay eſtimable profite yet god maketh v perceiue infirmity wee knew therby prouoked cal vpō though wherted v therevnto otherſide whereas taken correction come haphazarde taught receiue hand make profit thē whē ſo ſtriken bee better diſpozed ſeke heauenly life ſuche royſt worldward turne away frō god contrariwiſe bee ouermaiſtred god hath caſt v downe ground brought ſo lowe feeble wote become end make v cleaue vnto taſte better ſpirituall welfare prepared v wee none thing theſe ought know thing written iob performed v haue true example therfore let v ſuffer god handle v deale benefites v himſelfe ſhall ſee good howſoeuer fare let v aſſure ſelues end ſhall alwaies happie 〈…〉 none thing afflicti 〈…〉 rue bring v glorie lord ieſus chriſt 〈…〉 taken world ſhal 〈…〉 companie ſonne god angel 〈…〉 honor thē although ſharpe 〈…〉 ard fleſh yet notwithſtanding haue 〈…〉 reioyce continually yeeld thankes vnto god ſpecially hee deliuereth v preſent mi • erie howbeit foraſmuch could diſcharg 〈…〉 length ynough haue ſhort ſumme 〈…〉 ings ſayd forbeare ſpeake 〈…〉 iobs daughter effect ſcripture mēt betokē god made proſper ſuche wiſe worldward may ſee eye fauored yea euen beyond commō rate let v thinke ••• aunge god woulde thoſe dayes vtter loue towardes faithfull earthly tranſitorie proſperitie heauenly life ſo perfectly diſcouered 〈…〉 nowadayes goſpell ieſus chriſt yet manifeſted came downe hither lift v vp clothed himſelfe fleſh ſhew god dwelleth v hath ioyned v glorie immortalitie theſe thing yet come paſſe therfore behoued faithfull handled partly like little child cauſe auncient father ſpoken ſcripture purpoſely ſaid god bliſſed ofſpring cattell poſſeſsions ſuch thing ſpecially length life ſo helped thoſe meanes wayting till heauenly life diſcouered vnto v vnto lord ieſus chriſt hath opened gate paradiſe comming make v mount vp loft god make v proſper ſo much worldwarde wee muſt greeued ſtate worſe thā ſtate auncient father wee haue afarre better recompence ought comfort v example let v take whiche ſaid concerning long life god law hath highly eſteemed long life gaue faithfull yet notwithſtanding many vnbeleeuers vtter reprobate haue liued long therfore muſt reſt foraſmuch benefite may cōmon well god enimies friend ſouereine good thing true perfect happineſſe commeth farre ſhort muſt alſo adde ſecond point father old time knewe yet ſo perfectly wee god prepared heritage heauen true ſome taſte ſame faith haue yet ſuch opening wee haue lord ieſus chriſt therefore meet god ſhould let liue long make profit knowledge long experience world lo iob liued long time adayes life ſhorter bycauſe ieſus chriſt appeared vnto v hath ſhewed v ſtraungers worlde might runne heritage purchaſed bloud thing ſhadowes confirmed viſible benefites haue ſubſtance ſhadowes figure paſt wee haue bodie lorde ieſus chriſt therfore wee muſt contented whatſoeuer god giueth v referre ſelues wholy guiding furthermore let v vnderſtand wee muſt bee contented life haue liued whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god take v world true ſcripture ſpeaketh ſo iob abraham died olde men full ſatisfied dayes expreſſe temporall bliſſing haue ſpoken howſoeuer fared neither iob abraham ſuch like would euer haue bin ſatisfied liuing worlde amed better excellēt end ye ſee thē requiſit god ſhould prolong life end giue longer experience goodneſſe thing nowe ſo requiſite v whiche haue large declaration god fatherly loue towards v therfore behoueth v ſatisfied life diſpoſe ſelues die ſhall pleaſe god ſo may go hence glad hart gnaſhing teeth vnbeleeuers liued hundred thouſand yeres yet would faine tary beneath ſtill haue none hope preſent life ſeemeth thē death diſpatcheth cauſe neuer redy go world contrariwiſe father old time wont confirme faith length life god gaue thē therwithal diſpoſed themſelues depart whenſoeuer god liſted take hence himſelfe ought ſide nowadays haue told alredie muſt loke liue long take knowledge god fatherly loue therby liued three dayes world inough giue v taſt god goodneſſe mercie cōfirme faith ſeeing lord ieſus chriſt hath died riſe need long time world know god father ſure ſaluation therfore ſoone giueth v knowledge truth goſpell let v alwayes readie die aſſuring ſelues hee hath adopted v child ſhew himſelfe father life death ye ſee muſt alwayes ſatisfied life ſeeing god hath giuē v ſo good pledge loue lorde ieſus chriſt muſt deſire haue life prolonged end haue larger confirmation thereof vvherfore let v continually pray hauing guided v cōtinually holy ſpirit draw v hence himſelfe wee may come thither full ſatisfied bycauſe hath nouriſhed mainteyned v ſhewed v true life euerlaſting happineſſe prepared v aboue let v fal face good god acknowledgement ſinnes praying vouchſafe touch v may come true repentance frame ſelues rightuouſneſſe aſmuch wretched ſinners wrapped ouerwhelmed ſo many temptatiōs impoſsible v diſcharge ſelues hundreth part dutie may pleaſe ayde v holy ſpirite beare infirmity imperfection vntill hee haue quite cleane rid v ſo let v al ſay almightie god heauenly
